column1: title^level^race^category^quest_giver^quest_ender^quest_line^required_quests^unlocked_quests^objective^description
Sharptalon's Claw^30^Horde^Ashenvale^Sharptalon's Claw^Senani Thunderheart^^The Ashenvale Hunt^The Hunt Completed^Bring Sharptalon's Claw to Senani Thunderheart at Splintertree Post
column2: Ashenvale.^The mighty hippogryph Sharptalon has been slain
column3: with the claw of the felled beast serving as a testament to your victory. Senani Thunderheart at the Splintertree Post will no doubt be interested in seeing this trophy as proof of your deeds.

column1: Jitters' Growling Gut^20^Alliance^Duskwood^Jitters^Chef Grual^Jitters' Growling Gut^Raven Hill^^Speak with Chef Grual.^I've been stuck hiding in this ghost town for weeks
column2: and I haven't eaten anything but grubs and weeds! I need some decent food
column3: and I'm willing to trade well for it. Bring me a feast and I'll pay you handsomely. I heard Chef Grual at the Scarlet Raven Tavern in Darkshire makes very good Dusky Crab Cakes...

column1: Bounty on Garrick Padfoot^5^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Deputy Willem^Deputy Willem^^Brotherhood of Thieves^^Kill Garrick Padfoot and bring his head to Deputy Willem at Northshire Abbey.^Garrick Padfoot - a cutthroat who's plagued our farmers and merchants for weeks - was seen at a shack near the vineyards
column2: which lies east of the Abbey and across the bridge. Bring me the villain's head
column3: and earn his bounty! But be wary
column4: <name>. Garrick has gathered a gang of thugs around him. He will not be an easy man to reach.

column1: Kobold Camp Cleanup^2^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Marshal McBride^Marshal McBride^A Threat Within^^Investigate Echo Ridge
column2: Simple Letter
column3: Consecrated Letter
column4: Encrypted Letter
column5: Hallowed Letter
column6: Glyphic Letter
column7: Tainted Letter^Kill 8 Kobold Vermin
column8: then return to Marshal McBride.^Your first task is one of cleansing
column9: <name>. A clan of kobolds have infested the woods to the north. Go there and fight the kobold vermin you find. Reduce their numbers so that we may one day drive them from Northshire.

column1: A Rogue's Deal^5^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Calvin Montague^Innkeeper Renee^^^A Rogue's Deal^Deliver the Nondescript Letter to Innkeeper Renee in Tirisfal Glades.^Hey
column2: mate! Do a favor for a young man who's been fighting more than his fair share of mindless zombies and spiders? I got this here letter that needs to go to Brill... to an innkeeper named Renee something-or-other. Don't really matter none what her last name is. Anyway
column3: it's a nice cozy little place full of victims of the plague trying to make their way in the world. And it be a great spot for you to rest too if the need arises. You should check it out... you do and I'll pay you well.

column1: The Killing Fields^15^Alliance^Westfall^Farmer Saldean^Farmer Saldean^^^^Farmer Saldean wants you to kill 20 Harvest Watchers.^Look at what has happened to this place! These lands were once occupied by good farm folk. But the damned thieves have driven them all off. Not me
column2: though! But it seems some Harvest Watchers have taken over the fields. If you're up for the work
column3: I'd like you to go out and kill twenty of them. Come back when you're done for your pay. If you finish up with the ones in my field
column4: clear them from the neighboring fields as well.

column1: The Scrimshank Redemption^48^All^Tanaris^Senior Surveyor Fizzledowser^Senior Surveyor Fizzledowser^The Scrimshank Redemption^Noxious Lair Investigation^^Discover the fate of Junior Surveyor Scrimshank
column2: and bring either him or his surveying equipment to Senior Surveyor Fizzledowser in Gadgetzan.^Oh
column3: this is just terrible! I sent out my top assistant
column4: Junior Surveyor Scrimshank
column5: into the desert southeast of here. That's an area we call the Gaping Chasm. Well
column6: he's gone missing
column7: and his last report had more of those weird bugs where he was. Could it be that they've infested two major regions of the desert now? I need you to head into the Gaping Chasm and look for Scrimshank
column8: please! That... or at least find his surveying equipment. I fear that may be all that is left of the poor sod.

column1: Riverpaw Gnoll Bounty^10^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Deputy Rainer^Deputy Rainer^Westbrook Garrison Needs Help!^^^Bring 8 Painted Gnoll Armbands to Deputy Rainer at the Barracks.^Gnolls
column2: brutish creatures with no decent business in these lands
column3: have been seen along the borders of Elwynn Forest. A large pack of them
column4: many more than we can handle alone
column5: have infested the woods south of the guard tower yonder. Another group has infested the areas near Stone Cairn Lake to the east. The Stormwind Army will commend whomever helps kill them. Bring me their painted gnoll armbands as proof of your deed.

column1: The People's Militia^12^Alliance^Westfall^Gryan Stoutmantle^Gryan Stoutmantle^The People's Militia^^^Gryan Stoutmantle wants you to kill 15 Defias Trappers and 15 Defias Smugglers then return to him on Sentinel Hill.^The People's Militia has but one goal: To defend the lands of Westfall and return peace to our surroundings. Unfortunately
column2: the price of peace is often blood. One of my scouts has brought word of a band of Defias Trappers wreaking havoc nearby. I have reports of Defias Trapper sightings near the Jangolode Mine to the Northwest as well as at the Molsen Farm and Furlbrow's Pumpkin Farm. If you seek to join our ranks
column3: slay 15 Defias Trappers and 15 Defias Smugglers then return to me.

column1: The People's Militia^14^Alliance^Westfall^Gryan Stoutmantle^Gryan Stoutmantle^The People's Militia^^^Gryan Stoutmantle wants you to kill 15 Defias Pillagers and 15 Defias Looters and return to him on Sentinel Hill.^A band of vicious Defias Pillagers has been seen plundering the Gold Coast Quarry
column2: Moonbrook and the Alexston Farmstead. The People's Militia will not stand for such behavior. Dispatch immediately
column3: <name>
column4: and make the Light's presence known in Westfall. The Gold Coast Quarry is near the shore
column5: to the West of the tower. As the next step of your training
column6: I want you to kill 15 of those foul Defias Pillagers and 15 Defias Looters.

column1: The People's Militia^17^Alliance^Westfall^Gryan Stoutmantle^Gryan Stoutmantle^The People's Militia^^^Gryan Stoutmantle wants you to kill 15 Defias Highwaymen
column2: 5 Defias Pathstalkers and 5 Defias Knuckledusters then return to him on Sentinel Hill.^Some Defias have eluded us. My most trusted scout reports that these Defias have been looting and pillaging the countryside
column3: all the way into Southern Westfall. We believe they are hiding out in the Dagger Hills
column4: plotting their next move. Slay the wretches in the name of The People's Militia.

column1: Investigate Echo Ridge^3^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Marshal McBride^Marshal McBride^Investigate Echo Ridge^Kobold Camp Cleanup^^Kill 8 Kobold Workers
column2: then report back to Marshal McBride.^<name>
column3: my scouts tell me that the kobold infestation is larger than we had thought. A group of kobold workers has camped near the Echo Ridge Mine to the north. Go to the mine and remove them. We know there are at least 8. Kill them
column4: see if there are more
column5: then report back to me.

column1: Uldaman Reagent Run^42^Alliance^Loch Modan^Ghak Healtouch^Ghak Healtouch^^Badlands Reagent Run^^Bring 12 Magenta Fungus Caps to Ghak Healtouch in Thelsamar.^I've heard about a newly discovered plant called the magenta fungus caps. They grow in clusters at the Uldaman dig site and can be found in the early tunnels and deep within the less-explored areas. I want to study their potential use in alchemy
column2: and that's where you come in. Find the magenta cap clusters and bring me a dozen caps. Be warned
column3: the clusters may spew out poison spores if jostled. Do this for me
column4: and I'll whip up a batch of one of my famous restorative elixirs for you!

column1: Brotherhood of Thieves^4^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Deputy Willem^Deputy Willem^^A Threat Within^Bounty on Garrick Padfoot^Bring 8 Red Burlap Bandanas to Deputy Willem outside the Northshire Abbey.^Recently
column2: a new group of thieves has been hanging around Northshire. They call themselves the Defias Brotherhood
column3: and have been seen across the river to the east. I don't know what they're up to
column4: but I'm sure it's not good! Bring me the bandanas they wear
column5: and I'll reward you with a weapon.

column1: Tharil'zun^25^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Marshal Marris^Marshal Marris^Blackrock Menace^^^Bring Tharil'zun's Head to Marshal Marris in Redridge.^Blackrock Outrunners and Renegades are running ambushes between here and Stonewatch Keep. The leader of the Outrunners is an orc named Tharil'zun--we want this orc. Bring me the head of Tharil'zun!

Blackrock Menace^21^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Marshal Marris^Marshal Marris^Blackrock Menace^^Shadow Magic^Bring 10 Battleworn Axes to Marshal Marris in Lakeshire.^The Blackrock orcs have travelled from the Burning Steppes and claimed Stonewatch Keep to the north. From there they maraud the areas north of Lakeshire and keep its citizens in town
column2: penned like cattle. Help rid Lakeshire of this menace. Kill these Blackrock orcs and bring me ten of their Battleworn Axes as proof. And although Blackrocks threaten us from the north
column3: we've received reports of more in the southeastern pocket of Redridge. If you find any there
column4: then they too should be hunted.

column1: Skirmish at Echo Ridge^5^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Marshal McBride^Marshal McBride^Investigate Echo Ridge^^Report to Goldshire^Kill 8 Kobold Laborers
column2: then return to Marshal McBride at Northshire Abbey.^Your previous investigations are proof that the Echo Ridge Mine needs purging. Return to the mine and help clear it of kobolds. Waste no time
column3: <name>. The longer the kobolds are left unmolested in the mine
column4: the deeper a foothold they gain in Northshire.

column1: Goretusk Liver Pie^12^Alliance^Westfall^Salma Saldean^Salma Saldean^^^^Salma Saldean needs 8 Goretusk livers to make a Goretusk Liver Pie.^The onions are peeled. The garlic is minced. The rosemary is crushed. The crust has been baked. The dill weed is chopped. The gravy is simmering. Now all I need for my famous meat pie are 8 Goretusk Livers!
Ursangous's Paw^24^Horde^Ashenvale^Ursangous's Paw^Senani Thunderheart^^The Ashenvale Hunt^The Hunt Completed^Bring Ursangous's Paw to Senani Thunderheart at Splintertree Post
column2: Ashenvale.^The paw of the mighty bear Ursangous is your trophy for this part of the Ashenvale Hunt. On the paw is a small quarter-crescent emblem; the significance of the emblem remains a mystery. The paw should be brought to Senani Thunderheart in Splintertree Post to prove that you have bested the mighty creature and completed this portion of the hunt.

column1: Shadumbra's Head^27^Horde^Ashenvale^Shadumbra's Head^Senani Thunderheart^^The Ashenvale Hunt^The Hunt Completed^Bring Shadumbra's Head to Senani Thunderheart at Splintertree Post
column2: Ashenvale.^The once swift Shadumbra now lies still as you claim victory over it. The head of the slain nightsaber is a fitting trophy for this fight of the Ashenvale Hunt. Senani Thunderheart at Splintertree Post will want to see such a trophy to award you credit for this part of the Ashenvale Hunt.

column1: Stonetalon Standstill^25^Horde^Ashenvale^Mastok Wrilehiss^Mastok Wrilehiss^^^^Dispatch 12 Befouled Water Elementals at Mystral Lake
column2: due east of the Talondeep Path and southwest of Splintertree Post.^If you want to be useful
column3: then why don't you do something about the situation near Talondeep Path? The transports between Ashenvale and Stonetalon are at a standstill because of the lake coming alive and attacking anything that gets close... which means anyone on the path. What'd be even more useful than just putting the hammer down on the water elementals there is someone scouting the gazebo on Mystral Lake - the one that has a solid view of the Alliance outpost there. You up for being useful?

column1: A Lesson to Learn^16^Night Elf^Druid^Mathrengyl Bearwalker^Dendrite Starblaze^A Lesson to Learn^^^Speak with Dendrite Starblaze in the village of Nighthaven
column2: Moonglade.^<name>
column3: I have been following your progress with much delight. You are most assuredly developing yourself into a valued protector of nature. The time has come for you to learn more about one of the various animal aspects that Cenarius has blessed us with the ability to change into - one that affords you command and mastery of the water. For this
column4: you must travel to the village of Nighthaven in Moonglade and speak with Dendrite Starblaze of the Cenarion Circle there. He will guide you further.

column1: A Lesson to Learn^16^Tauren^Druid^Turak Runetotem^Dendrite Starblaze^A Lesson to Learn^^^Speak with Dendrite Starblaze in the village of Nighthaven
column2: Moonglade.^<name>
column3: I have been following your progress with much delight. You are most assuredly developing yourself into a valued protector of nature. The time has come for you to learn more about one of the various animal aspects that Cenarius has blessed us with the ability to change into - one that affords you command and mastery of the water. For this
column4: you must travel to the village of Nighthaven in Moonglade and speak with Dendrite Starblaze of the Cenarion Circle there. He will guide you further.

column1: Trial of the Lake^16^Tauren^Druid^Dendrite Starblaze^Tajarri^A Lesson to Learn^^^Find a Shrine Bauble in Lake Elune'ara
column2: and take it to the Shrine of Remulos in northwestern Moonglade. Once there
column3: use the Shrine Bauble.^For your first trial
column4: search the depths of Lake Elune'ara to locate a Shrine Bauble. It decays rapidly
column5: so proceed with it to the Shrine of Remulos post haste. Use the bauble at the shrine
column6: and then speak with Tajarri there; she is one of Moonglade's most trusted wardens. You only have a set amount of time to complete the task
column7: and you may be competing against other druids searching for baubles themselves. Mental and physical dexterity will be critical to your success. Good luck
column8: <name>.

column1: Trial of the Lake^16^Night Elf^Druid^Dendrite Starblaze^Tajarri^A Lesson to Learn^^^Find a Shrine Bauble in Lake Elune'ara
column2: and take it to the Shrine of Remulos in northwestern Moonglade. Once there
column3: use the Shrine Bauble.^For your first trial
column4: search the depths of Lake Elune'ara to locate a Shrine Bauble. It decays rapidly
column5: so proceed with it to the Shrine of Remulos post haste. Use the bauble at the shrine
column6: and then speak with Tajarri there; she is one of Moonglade's most trusted wardens. You only have a set amount of time to complete the task
column7: and you may be competing against other druids searching for baubles themselves. Mental and physical dexterity will be critical to your success. Good luck
column8: <name>.

column1: Trial of the Sea Lion^16^Tauren^Druid^Tajarri^Dendrite Starblaze^A Lesson to Learn^^^Find the Half Pendant of Aquatic Agility and the Half Pendant of Aquatic Endurance. Speak with the residents of Moonglade to learn clues as to where these items may be located.^For the second trial
column2: you'll need the two halves that make the Pendant of the Sea Lion. One half draws power from the agility of the sea lion aspect
column3: gliding through water; the other draws power from the incredible endurance of the sea lion aspect. Druids draw on both these traits equally to embody the aspect of their aquatic form. Speak with the locals of Moonglade to learn where the parts may lie
column4: and bring both here to join them together. Once formed
column5: take the pendant to Dendrite Starblaze.

column1: Aquatic Form^16^Tauren^Druid^Dendrite Starblaze^Turak Runetotem^A Lesson to Learn^^^Return to Thunder Bluff and show Turak Runetotem the Pendant of the Sea Lion.^You have completed the necessary lessons all young druids are taught before they can adopt an aquatic aspect. Go now back to your trainer
column2: Turak Runetotem
column3: in Thunder Bluff. Show him your pendant and prove to him you are ready to learn what he has to teach you. He will complete your training
column4: allowing you to become one with the water. Goodbye
column5: young druid. We shall speak again.

column1: Rise of the Silithid^48^Horde^Tanaris^Senior Surveyor Fizzledowser^Zilzibin Drumlore^^Insect Part Analysis^^Take the report to Zilzibin Drumlore in Orgrimmar.^Here's your report. I urge you to take it to someone who might have working knowledge in this kind of thing. I know this troll scholar named Zilzibin Drumlore. He's spent a lot of time studying life forms that are unique to the ecology of Azeroth; he's a historian to boot! If you want someone to help figure out what exactly this threat is and how to stop it
column2: give this report to him. We're going to need all the help we can get. Zil lives in a house on the second tier of the Drag in Orgrimmar.

column1: Wolves Across the Border^2^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Eagan Peltskinner^Eagan Peltskinner^Eagan Peltskinner^^Milly Osworth^Bring 8 Diseased Wolf Pelts to Eagan Peltskinner outside Northshire Abbey.^Whatever is affecting these wolves isn't going away. Each day that passes brings forth more sick wolves. It pains me to ask anyone to kill nature's beasts
column2: but we must destroy the diseased young wolves before this little outbreak turns into an epidemic. Kill diseased young wolves in the valley and bring me their diseased wolf pelts as proof of your deed.

column1: An Unwelcome Guest^24^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Martie Jainrose^Martie Jainrose^^^^Martie Jainrose of Lakeshire wants you to kill Bellygrub. Bring her his tusk as proof.^Once again my garden was trampled and pillaged. And I know the brute who is doing it. It's that forsaken boar
column2: the one Marshal Marris has taken to calling Bellygrub. I won't be able to re-plant the daffodils until next season now. Ruined! All ruined by that one menacing boar. Put an end to that pest! Show me his tusk and I'd be happy to reward you. He seems to spend his time foraging in the field southwest of Lakeshire but occasionally he roams over here and into my garden.

column1: Further Concerns^10^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Marshal Dughan^Guard Thomas^A Fishy Peril^^^Marshal Dughan wants you to speak with Guard Thomas.^If you are concerned that the rumors of murlocs are true
column2: then do this -- travel to the eastern Elwynn bridge and speak with Guard Thomas. He has been stationed at the bridge for the past week and will know the state of the area. Bring me his report.

column1: Westfall Stew^10^Alliance^Westfall^Verna Furlbrow^Salma Saldean^^^Westfall Stew^Verna Furlbrow wants you to deliver her recipe for Westfall Stew to Salma Saldean.^I never thought the day would come when I'd leave the farm. But the fields are overrun with thieves and it's far too dangerous for us here now. As soon as Farmer Furlbrow gets the wagon fixed
column2: we'll be on our way. Maybe you could do me a favor? Let me scribble down my recipe for Westfall stew. Please take it to Salma Saldean over on the farm yonder. The Saldean's farm is just beyond the fork in the road.

column1: Find the Lost Guards^10^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Guard Thomas^A half-eaten body^A Fishy Peril^^^Guard Thomas wants you to travel north up the river and search for the two lost guards
column2: Rolf and Malakai.^A few days ago we sent two Guards
column3: Rolf and Malakai
column4: to investigate along the river
column5: and they have not yet returned. To complete my report
column6: I must know what happened to those men. Travel north along the river and find the guards... or their remains.

column1: Westfall Stew^13^Alliance^Westfall^Salma Saldean^Salma Saldean^^Westfall Stew^^Salma Saldean wants 3 Stringy Vulture Meat
column2: 3 Goretusk Snouts
column3: 3 Murloc Eyes
column4: 3 Okra.^Help me make some Westfall Stew! Come back with the following ingredients:  3 Stringy Vulture Meat 3 Goretusk Snouts 3 Murloc Eyes 3 Okra

column1: Deliver Thomas' Report^10^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Guard Thomas^Marshal Dughan^A Fishy Peril^^Bounty on Murlocs^Report to Marshal Dughan in Goldshire.^Tell Marshal Dughan of Malakai and Rolf's deaths
column2: and report to him that the Murlocs in eastern Elwynn cannot be contained by our current troop presence. I know we don't have many troops to spare
column3: but hopefully Dughan can find someone.

column1: A Fishy Peril^10^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Remy "Two Times"^Marshal Dughan^A Fishy Peril^^^Remy "Two Times" wants you to speak with Marshal Dughan in Goldshire.^<name>
column2: there's a new threat in Elwynn Forest! Murlocs are swimming up the streams of eastern Elwynn
column3: scaring away fish and attacking gentle folk! I warned Marshal Dughan
column4: but he's more worried about the gnolls and the bandits. He's not convinced that the murlocs are a danger. Please
column5: <name>
column6: speak to Dughan and persuade him to send more troops to the east!

column1: Discover Rolf's Fate^10^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^A half-eaten body^Rolf's corpse^A Fishy Peril^^^Search the murloc village for Rolf
column2: or signs of his death.^Upon further searching the area
column3: you find webbed footprints leading east along the shore of Stone Cairn Lake. In the distance to the east
column4: you can just barely see a Murloc village. Perhaps Rolf's fate ended there...

column1: Bounty on Murlocs^10^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Guard Thomas^Guard Thomas^^Deliver Thomas' Report^^Bring 8 Torn Murloc Fins to Guard Thomas at the east Elwynn bridge.^The Stormwind Army has placed a bounty on murloc lurkers and foragers in Elwynn. Slaughter them and bring me their torn murloc fins
column2: and the Stormwind Army will reward you well. The murlocs have built a village at Stone Cairn Lake north of here
column3: and another to the south where the stream forks.

column1: Gold Dust Exchange^7^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Remy "Two Times"^Remy "Two Times"^^^^Bring 10 Gold Dust to Remy "Two Times" in Goldshire. Gold Dust is gathered from Kobolds in Elwynn Forest.^The Kobolds in these parts sometimes carry Gold Dust on them. I could really use the stuff - bring me a load of it and I'll give you the best price in town...best price in town! You can find kobolds in the Fargodeep Mine to the south
column2: and around the Jasperlode Mine to the northeast.

column1: Sweet Amber^44^Alliance^Westfall^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^Sweet Amber^^^Bring Holy Spring Water to Grimbooze Thunderbrew.^In the land to the south where vines twist and creepLies a hidden well where the water runs deepPure as the Light's sacred DaughterBring to me now some Holy Spring Water.
Sweet Amber^44^Alliance^Westfall^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^Sweet Amber^^^Grimbooze Thunderbrew wants a Sack of Barley
column2: a Sack of Rye and a Sack of Corn.^Amber is the hue of my life's longest loveLike the last embers of dusk in the sky aboveRetrieve for me so that my love shall be bornOne sack of each: barley
column3: rye and corn.

column1: Sweet Amber^44^Alliance^Westfall^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^Sweet Amber^^^Grimbooze Thunderbrew wants Truesilver.^I'll mix and mix till we have a mashFor this will be our own private stashA still must be fashioned of metal strongBring me some Truesilver so I can finish this song.

Sweet Amber^44^Alliance^Westfall^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^Sweet Amber^^^Bring a Sycamore Branch to Grimbooze Thunderbrew.^Not yet filtered but freshly distilledLike unseeded land waiting there tilled.Next I will fashion our pile of charcoalDeliver a sycamore branch
column2: that is your next goal.

column1: Protect the Frontier^10^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Guard Thomas^Guard Thomas^^^^Kill 8 Prowlers and 5 Young Forest Bears
column2: and then return to Guard Thomas at the east Elwynn bridge.^Hail
column3: <name>. Wild animals are growing more and more aggressive the farther we get from Goldshire
column4: and the Eastvale Logging Camp suffers nearly constant attacks from wolves and bears! We could use your help out here.

column1: Sweet Amber^44^Alliance^Westfall^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^Sweet Amber^^^Bring Grimbooze Thunderbrew a bundle of Charred Oak.^Mellifluous liquid clear as a baby's tearsTurns a lovely deep amber over the yearsBut before we proceed to get lit to the hiltA barrel of charred oak must be built.
Report to Goldshire^5^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Marshal McBride^Marshal Dughan^^Skirmish at Echo Ridge^^Take Marshal McBride's Documents to Marshal Dughan in Goldshire.^<name>
column2: you are a <class> with proven interest in the security of Northshire. You are now tasked with the protection of the surrounding Elwynn Forest. If you accept this duty
column3: then I have prepared papers that must be delivered to Marshal Dughan in Goldshire. Goldshire lies along the southern road
column4: past the border gates.

column1: Morbent Fel^32^All^Duskwood^Sven Yorgen^Sven Yorgen^Sven's Revenge^^^Use Morbent's Bane on Morbent Fel
column2: kill Morbent Fel
column3: then return Morbent's Bane to Sven at his camp.^Morbent Fel hides in his lair
column4: the house perched atop the hill to the east overlooking the Raven Hill cemetery. His time in this land is drawing to an end... Use Morbent's Bane against him. It will render his protective magics powerless. Slay him. Slay him
column5: and save us from his wickedness. Be the instrument of my revenge
column6: and a hero of Duskwood!

column1: The Night Watch^24^Alliance^Duskwood^Commander Althea Ebonlocke^Commander Althea Ebonlocke^The Night Watch^^^Commander Althea Ebonlocke of Darkshire wants you to kill 8 Skeletal Warriors and 6 Skeletal Mages.^As Commander of The Night Watch it is my sworn duty to protect the citizens of Darkshire. Stormwind has retracted their commissioned guards from their posts here
column2: leaving us to our own devices. If you feel worthy of the task
column3: we need your help! Assist The Night Watch by venturing forth into Tranquil Gardens
column4: just south of Darkshire
column5: and slaying 8 Skeletal Warriors and 6 Skeletal Mages. The undead threat must be thwarted!

column1: The Night Watch^26^Alliance^Duskwood^Commander Althea Ebonlocke^Commander Althea Ebonlocke^The Night Watch^^^Commander Althea Ebonlocke of Darkshire wants you to kill 15 Skeletal Fiends and 15 Skeletal Horrors.^<name>
column2: I'm getting reports of an undead infestation in the forest! If you're up to the job
column3: journey to the Raven Hill graveyard and slay 15 of those vile Skeletal Fiends and 15 Skeletal Horrors. There are also reports of skeletons just south of Darkshire
column4: in and around Tranquil Gardens Cemetery. The undead must be driven from Duskwood!

column1: The Night Watch^30^Alliance^Duskwood^Commander Althea Ebonlocke^Commander Althea Ebonlocke^The Night Watch^^^Commander Althea Ebonlocke of Darkshire wants you to kill 20 Plague Spreaders in the eastern Raven Hill mausoleum.^The situation in Raven Hill is still grim. The safety of Darkshire is in your hands
column2: <name>. I don't have enough Watchers to keep the town safe. We need you to dispatch for Raven Hill yet again and rid the eastern mausoleum of 20 Plague Spreaders!

column1: Cloth and Leather Armor^10^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Marshal Dughan^Sara Timberlain^A Fishy Peril^^^Give Sara Timberlain the Stormwind Armor Marker.^For your shrewdness and valor
column2: I have a marker here that is good for one piece of armor. I want you to take it to Sara Timberlain at the Eastvale Logging Camp. Give her the marker
column3: and she will fashion the armor for you. And after you receive it
column4: <name>
column5: use it in the defense of Elwynn. The Eastvale Logging Camp is beyond Guard Thomas' post to the east.

column1: Kobold Candles^7^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^William Pestle^William Pestle^Kobold Candles^^^Bring 8 Large Candles to William Pestle in Goldshire.^Hello
column2: <good sir/my lady>! Do you have a moment? My brother and I run an apothecary in Stormwind
column3: and I'm here to gather large candles for their wax. Can you help me? You can get large candles from kobolds
column4: and I hear rumors that kobolds are infesting the Elwynn mines ... the Fargodeep mine to the south and Jasperlode Mine to the east. I suggest looking for candles in one of those places.

column1: Shipment to Stormwind^7^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^William Pestle^Morgan Pestle^Kobold Candles^^^Bring William's Shipment to Morgan Pestle in the Stormwind Trade District.^My brother Morgan is waiting in Stormwind for my shipment of candles. I don't have enough time to make the trip myself
column2: but if you'd like to take him the shipment
column3: he'll pay you well. I've packed up the candles
column4: and you can find Morgan in our shop
column5: Pestle's Apothecary
column6: in the Stormwind Trade District.

column1: The Fargodeep Mine^7^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Marshal Dughan^Marshal Dughan^The Fargodeep Mine^^^Explore the Fargodeep Mine
column2: then return to Marshal Dughan in Goldshire.^The mine in Northshire isn't the only one with problems! I have reports that the Fargodeep Mine in Elwynn has also become a haven for Kobolds. Explore the mine and confirm these reports
column3: then return to me. The mine is almost due south of Goldshire
column4: between the Stonefield and Maclure homesteads.

column1: Call of Water^20^Horde^Shaman^Islen Waterseer^Brazier of Everfount^Call of Water^Call of Water^^Defeat the Corrupt Manifestation of Water and place the Corrupted Manifestation's Bracers along with the Remaining Drops of Purest Water on the Brazier of Everfount in Silverpine Forest.^Along the coast of Silverpine
column2: west of the Sepulcher
column3: you will find a shrine that has become tainted by the plague. The spirits there no longer speak to our people and it will be up to you to defeat the manifestation and cleanse the pool. Take the elemental's bracers
column4: along with the remaining drops of Brine's potion
column5: and place them on the brazier. The ritual should be enough to summon a pure spirit for you to communicate with. Bring me proof the task is done
column6: and I will reward you with your totem.

column1: The Forgotten Heirloom^12^Alliance^Westfall^Farmer Furlbrow^Farmer Furlbrow^^^^Farmer Furlbrow wants you to retrieve his pocket watch from the wardrobe in his farmhouse at the pumpkin farm to the West.^It was horrible! Verna woke me when she heard a ruckus in the fields. The fields were full of hooligans. We left in a rush and I forgot to pack my pocket watch. Verna's pa gave me that watch on our wedding day and I feel just sick knowing those thieves have it. I left the pocket watch in the wardrobe at the farmhouse. Look for the field of pumpkins to the West -- you can't miss it. If you bring it back to me
column2: I'd sure be grateful!

column1: The Defias Brotherhood^18^Alliance^Westfall^Gryan Stoutmantle^Wiley the Black^The Defias Brotherhood^^^Gryan Stoutmantle wants you to talk to Wiley in Lakeshire.^The band of wretches responsible for driving the good people of Westfall from the land call themselves The Defias Brotherhood. I need you to infiltrate this clan of thugs. We need to know who heads up the cartel and where they are hiding out. In Lakeshire
column2: in the inn
column3: there is a rogue by the name of Wiley who owes me a favor. Travel to Lakeshire in the Redridge Mountains
column4: east of Elwynn
column5: and find out what you can.

column1: The Legend of Stalvan^28^Alliance^Duskwood^Madame Eva^Clerk Daltry^The Legend of Stalvan^^^Seek out the Clerk Daltry in the Darkshire Town Hall.^Last night a horrible disturbance rippled through my veins. I sensed that my granddaughter
column2: Alyssa
column3: was in great danger. I consulted the cards and Death stared up at me from the table. After taking a long journey through a dark trance I was able to uncover a clue to this terrifying mystery. A name came to me
column4: the name of Stalvan. Seek out the Clerk in the Town Hall and see if you can find out more about this character. I fear for us all.

column1: The Legend of Stalvan^28^Alliance^Duskwood^Clerk Daltry^Old Footlocker^The Legend of Stalvan^^^Travel to the Moonbrook Schoolhouse and bring back any updated information about Stalvan to Clerk Daltry.^Stalvan
column2: eh? Let me check the town registry. Stalvan. . .Stalvan. . .let's see. Ah
column3: here we go! I have a record of a Mr. Stalvan Mistmantle. The last recorded address is the Moonbrook Schoolhouse. My
column4: talk about outdated! Do me a favor will you
column5: friend? If you happen to go out to Moonbrook
column6: let me know if you get any update on this fellow. I like to keep the records clean.

column1: The Legend of Stalvan^28^Alliance^Duskwood^Old Footlocker^Clerk Daltry^The Legend of Stalvan^^^Take the Dusty Unsent Letter to Clerk Daltry.^You find a Dusty Unsent Letter in the old footlocker.

The Legend of Stalvan^28^Alliance^Duskwood^Clerk Daltry^Innkeeper Farley^The Legend of Stalvan^^^Go to The Lion's Pride Inn to see if anyone there has heard of the name Stalvan.^Oh my! Must have missed this the first time. In the registry
column2: right beneath the first address for Stalvan there's another one listed
column3: only partially scratched out. Looks like he was headed to The Lion's Pride Inn over in Goldshire. Might want to check there
column4: <name>.

column1: The Legend of Stalvan^28^Alliance^Duskwood^Innkeeper Farley^Caretaker Folsom^The Legend of Stalvan^^^Retrieve Stalvan's Undelivered Letter from the chest and deliver it to the Canal District in Stormwind.^The name Stalvan rings a bell. I remember now. Many years back
column2: on a stormy night
column3: a messenger came in
column4: seeking refuge for the night. Near the stroke of midnight
column5: the man ran down the stairs screaming
column6: his face pale with fear. Still wearing his bedclothes
column7: he disappeared into the downpour. In his haste he forgot his letters in the chest upstairs. He never returned for them. One remains from that Stalvan fellow
column8: intended for the Canal District in Stormwind. Help yourself to it.

column1: Report to Thomas^10^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Rolf's corpse^Guard Thomas^A Fishy Peril^^^Deliver Rolf and Malakai's Medallions to Guard Thomas at the eastern Elwynn bridge.^Now that you have both medallions
column2: deliver them to Guard Thomas at the bridge so that he might know the fate of his murdered guards.

column1: The Legend of Stalvan^28^Alliance^Duskwood^Caretaker Folsom^Sealed Crate^The Legend of Stalvan^^^Search through the packed up possessions for a clue.^My father was the caretaker of the estate long before I was. He had to mop the blood up after the massacre. But that's neither here nor there. The last funds of the Flintridge trust have dried up. Now the last of the family possessions are headed for auction. Blame the tax vultures. I guess if you're really itching to learn more you're free to look through this junk. Who knows what you might find.

The Legend of Stalvan^28^Alliance^Duskwood^Sealed Crate^Marshal Haggard^The Legend of Stalvan^^^The Torn Journal page you discovered provides your next clue.^Inside the crate you find various objects: musty heirlooms
column2: a family portrait
column3: a few hunting trophies and some old books. Near the bottom
column4: underneath a ceramic vase
column5: you uncover A Torn Journal Page.

column1: The Legend of Stalvan^28^Alliance^Duskwood^Marshal Haggard^Marshal Haggard^The Legend of Stalvan^^^Marshal Haggard wants you to check the chest upstairs for the Faded Journal Page.^There was a bundle of parchments in the chest upstairs when I moved into this place. I looked at them once when I first arrived but I gave up once the fog hazed over my peepers. Do an old
column2: nearly-blind man a favor and check the chest upstairs for anything that might help you in your quest to discover more about this Stalvan character. I'm pretty sure there's a faded journal page that might be of interest to you. Bring it to me and I'll help in anyway I can.

column1: The Jasperlode Mine^10^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Marshal Dughan^Marshal Dughan^The Fargodeep Mine^^^Explore the Jasperlode Mine
column2: then report back to Marshal Dughan in Goldshire.^Thanks to you we know the Fargodeep Mine is infested with kobolds. Now we need a scout to investigate the more distant Jasperlode Mine. Explore Jasperlode and confirm any kobold presence. To reach the mine
column3: travel east along the road until you reach the Tower of Azora. From the tower
column4: head north and you'll find the mine in the foothills.

column1: A Sticky Situation^48^All^The Hinterlands^Gilveradin Sunchaser^Gilveradin Sunchaser^Ripple Recovery^^Ripple Delivery^Recover 10 bottles of Hinterlands Honey Ripple from the crates located around the abandoned Horde base in Skulk Rock.^I possess original packaging materials for the ripple Dran Droffers seeks. I will assist you in packaging the ripple for Malton's abrasive father... for a fee of two additional bottles of said ripple. They are located in crates found in the abandoned Horde base near Skulk Rock. It will be an arduous task
column2: to wit; foul slimes and oozes will be found sticking to the ruins; rumor has it they are led by some sort of master ooze. Regardless
column3: procure the ripple and return to me here for packaging.

column1: The Legend of Stalvan^28^Alliance^Duskwood^Marshal Haggard^Tavernkeep Smitts^The Legend of Stalvan^^^Take the Faded Journal Page to Tavernkeep Smitts at Darkshire in Duskwood.^I know of someone who might be able to assist you. Back when I was leading the Stormwind Guard
column2: we used to get drinks at the Scarlet Raven Tavern in Darkshire. The Innkeeper there
column3: Smitts
column4: was quite an expert on the local lore. Show him this page and see what he has to say about it.

column1: The Legend of Stalvan^28^Alliance^Duskwood^Tavernkeep Smitts^Commander Althea Ebonlocke^The Legend of Stalvan^^^Take the muddy page to Commander Ebonlocke.^I followed the legend of that Stalvan character for years. When those visiting nobles were slaughtered a few years back I went with Haggard to investigate. I found these muddy pages but we were never able to link the handwriting to that crazy man in the woods. Your trail of evidence proves his guilt. Take this to Commander Ebonlocke immediately and fill her in on what you've discovered!
The Legend of Stalvan^28^Alliance^Duskwood^Commander Althea Ebonlocke^Clerk Daltry^The Legend of Stalvan^^^Show Clerk Daltry the Bloodstained Journal Page.^I have had my eye on that creep
column2: Stalvan
column3: for quite sometime. But if this page was written by the same hand it proves his guilt beyond a shadow of a doubt. In all his days keeping the Town Registry
column4: Clerk Daltry has become an expert at identifying handwriting. Show him this page and see if the writing matches that of the registry signature.

column1: Ripple Delivery^48^All^Orgrimmar^Gilveradin Sunchaser^Dran Droffers^^A Sticky Situation^^Deliver the barrel to Dran Droffers in Orgrimmar.^I have taken the extra step of securing not only Dran's packaged ripple in the barrel
column2: but also the extra bottles of ripple he is purloining. While I may not hold Dran very highly
column3: there is nothing worse than jostled ripple. You're welcome. Now
column4: deliver yon barrel to Dran Droffers in his salvage emporium in Orgrimmar. Pray tell
column5: please extend my warmest greetings to Malton; let him know that should he ever thirst for fine drink and finer drinking companions
column6: we would be honored with his visit.

column1: Noxious Lair Investigation^47^All^Tanaris^Senior Surveyor Fizzledowser^Alchemist Pestlezugg^Gadgetzan Water Survey^^The Scrimshank Redemption^Bring five Centipaar insect parts from the Noxious Lair to Alchemist Pestlezugg in Gadgetzan.^All right now
column2: these reports about the bugs... what we know is that they are draining the water pools that used to be where the Noxious Lair is. What we DON'T know is
column3: well
column4: everything else. Let's figure out who our enemy is first! I want you to head into the Noxious Lair and get some parts off of those critters. Get five from the Centipaar there and bring them to Alchemist Pestlezugg for him to dink with. With him on the case
column5: we'll figure out what they are!

column1: Red Linen Goods^9^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Sara Timberlain^Sara Timberlain^^^^Bring 6 Red Linen Bandanas to Sara Timberlain at the Eastvale Logging Camp.^The Defias gang in Northshire wears burlap masks
column2: but the Defias in Elwynn wear linen which I can use to make fine linen goods. Bring me red linen bandanas and I'll use them to fashion something for you. Defias gang members have camps pocketed throughout Elwynn.

column1: Back to Billy^6^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^"Auntie" Bernice Stonefield^Billy Maclure^Lost Necklace^^^Bring the Pork Belly Pie to Billy Maclure at the Maclure Vineyards.^Here you go. And when you give this pie to that Billy
column2: you tell him I hope he chokes on it!

column1: Lost Necklace^6^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^"Auntie" Bernice Stonefield^Billy Maclure^Lost Necklace^^^Speak with Billy Maclure.^I lost my necklace
column2: and think that guttersnipe Billy Maclure took it! He's usually scuttling like a rat around the Maclure vineyards east of here. Get my necklace back for me
column3: and you'll warm an old widow's heart.

column1: Pie for Billy^6^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Billy Maclure^"Auntie" Bernice Stonefield^Lost Necklace^^^Bring 4 Chunks of Boar Meat to Auntie Bernice Stonefield at the Stonefield's Farm.^Maybe if I got a pie
column2: I could tell you who has that necklace. And you know
column3: I think that old Bernice lady at that other farm makes great Pork Belly Pies... Maybe if you gave her some chunks of boar meat from the boars that hang around our farms
column4: and told her what it was for
column5: she'd bake up a pie for you.

column1: Goldtooth^8^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Billy Maclure^"Auntie" Bernice Stonefield^Lost Necklace^^^Bring Bernice's Necklace to "Auntie" Bernice Stonefield at the Stonefield Farm.^I was playing near the Fargodeep Mine
column2: and I think I dropped
column3: er...I mean I saw
column4: the old lady's necklace. Don't ask me how it got there...it wasn't me! Well anyway
column5: I saw this big
column6: gold-toothed kobold pick up the necklace and run into the mine. Go find that kobold and you'll find the necklace
column7: I swear!

column1: Princess Must Die!^9^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Ma Stonefield^Ma Stonefield^^^^Kill Princess
column2: grab her collar
column3: then bring it back to Ma Stonefield at the Stonefield Farm.^The Brackwells have a prize-winning pig
column4: Princess. The sow is HUGE
column5: and she got that way from sneaking over here and eating my veggies! So before she comes to our fields...Princess must die! Bring me her collar as proof of the deed and I'll give you something for your time! Princess is usually over at the Brackwell Pumpkin Patch
column6: to the east and beyond the Maclure farm. Get her before she gets hungry and comes back here!

column1: The Everstill Bridge^20^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Foreman Oslow^Foreman Oslow^^^^Bring 5 Iron Pikes and 5 Iron Rivets to Foreman Oslow in Lakeshire.^During the last orc invasion we were forced to smelt our iron down to make bullets
column2: swords and armor. We sent word to Stormwind for a new shipment of materials but a band of Redridge gnolls hijacked the caravan and ran off into the hills behind Lakeshire. Now we're coming up short on supplies to get this bridge rebuilt. If you can bring me 5 iron pikes and 5 iron rivets
column3: <name>
column4: I'll make sure you're rewarded. Now let's get to work!

column1: Seasoned Wolf Kabobs^25^Alliance^Duskwood^Chef Grual^Chef Grual^^^^Gather 10 Lean Wolf Flanks and Stormwind Seasoning Herbs and return to Chef Grual in Darkshire.^Seasoned Wolf Kabobs are a house favorite! Sure
column2: I can make you some. But first I'll need the supplies. Bring me 10 Lean Wolf Flanks as well as some Stormwind Seasoning Herbs. There are so many wolves here in the forest
column3: I am sure finding the Flanks will be no problem. For the herbs
column4: seek out Felicia Gump in her canal district flower shop in Stormwind.

column1: Solomon's Law^23^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Bailiff Conacher^Bailiff Conacher^^^^Bring 10 Shadowhide Pendants to Bailiff Conacher in the Lakeshire Town Hall.^An enemy of Stormwind has taken up residence in the eastern foothills of Redridge. This wicked villain uses the Arcane to spread terror and misery upon our town and our people. Under the name
column2: Morganth
column3: he conducts his evil business. Morganth now controls the Shadowhide Gnoll Clan to perform his biddings. As stated by the Law of Lakeshire
column4: aiding a criminal of the Kingdom is punishable by death. These vile gnolls must be killed! Turn in 10 Shadowhide Pendants to me
column5: and you shall be rewarded.

column1: Redridge Goulash^18^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Chef Breanna^Chef Breanna^^^^Chef Breanna of Lakeshire wants five pieces of Tough Condor Meat
column2: five Great Goretusk Snouts and five helpings of Crisp Spider Meat.^Nothing would please me more than to make you some Redridge Goulash. But there's a slight problem. During the recent orc uprising I fed the entire brigade of Stormwind troops. My cupboard is now bare. But if you can provide me with the ingredients
column3: I'd be happy to oblige. Just bring me five pieces of Tough Condor Meat
column4: five Great Goretusk Snouts and five helpings of Crisp Spider Meat.

column1: Dusky Crab Cakes^20^Alliance^Duskwood^Chef Grual^Chef Grual^Jitters' Growling Gut^^^Gather 6 Gooey Spider Legs and bring them to Chef Grual in Darkshire.^I'll let you in on a little secret - Dusky "Crab" Cakes are really made from spider legs! I know it's a bit disgusting
column2: but the cakes have a nice
column3: tangy flavor and make great snacks! Bring me Gooey Spider Legs and I'll whip you up a few of them. I hear Venom Web Spiders are a good source - they nest to the north
column4: between the foothills and the river.

column1: A Watchful Eye^21^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Theocritus^Old Lion Statue^A Watchful Eye^^^Take the Glyph of Azora to the Lion Statue near the Tower of Ilgalar in Redridge.^My rival
column2: Morganth
column3: is a vicious mage of great power who lives in the Tower of Ilgalar in Redridge. I have developed a means of spying on him
column4: the Eye of Azora
column5: and can now view him from afar. But to study his thoughts ... I require further aid. If you are willing
column6: then take my Glyph of Azora to the Tower of Ilgalar. Place it upon the Lion Statue near the Tower. When this is done
column7: the power of Azora will grant visions of Morganth's future plans.

column1: Sven's Revenge^25^Alliance^Duskwood^Sven Yorgen^Mound of loose dirt^Sven's Revenge^^^Go to Sven's Farm and find what was buried behind the old stump.^I used to work one of the farms to the southeast...until Dark Riders from Deadwind Pass descended upon my farm and slaughtered my family when I was away! When I returned I saw a shadowy figure skulking near my barn
column2: burying something. He fled before I could catch him
column3: and I couldn't linger for I was hot on the heels of the Dark Riders. So I never discovered what was hidden. If you can find what that shadowy figure buried
column4: I would be grateful. The hiding spot is behind the old stump near my barn.

column1: Call of Water^20^Horde^Shaman^Minor Manifestation of Water^Islen Waterseer^Call of Water^^^Bring the Shard of Water to Islen Waterseer at the Tidus Stair in the Barrens.^Take shard. Take shard and give life. Give life and understand. Understand water is life... corruption stops life. You protect and give life with water's power.

The Legend of Stalvan^28^Alliance^Duskwood^Clerk Daltry^Commander Althea Ebonlocke^The Legend of Stalvan^^^Report the news to Commander Ebonlocke.^Let Commander Ebonlocke know immediately that the handwriting matched
column2: <name>! Her suspicions were correct!

column1: The Legend of Stalvan^32^Alliance^Duskwood^Commander Althea Ebonlocke^Madame Eva^The Legend of Stalvan^^^Kill Stalvan Mistmantle and show Madame Eva his family ring.^Stalvan Mistmantle led a life of depravity. Innocent victims died by his hand. Undoubtedly he is guilty of countless crimes. Now the lunatic threatens Darkshire. The Light only knows what sordid acts he is plotting. Travel to his cottage just north of town
column2: <class>
column3: and execute Stalvan
column4: once and for all. When the deed is done
column5: travel to Madame Eva's and show her his family ring. After all
column6: it was her premonition that led to this gruesome discovery. But Darkshire is safer because of her.

column1: Arugal's Folly^15^All^Silverpine Forest^Dalar Dawnweaver^Dalar Dawnweaver^Prove Your Worth^^^Bring 6 Pyrewood Shackles to Dalar Dawnweaver at the Sepulcher.^As my understanding of Arugal's magic grows so does my disdain for the hapless fool. I am close to completing my research on his so called remedy. My knowledge will be complete when I learn what enchantment is causing the strange behavior going on in Pyrewood Village. By day
column2: the peasants appear to be Human. But when the sun goes down the townsfolk turn into Moonrage Worgen. I need to draw energy from the enchanted shackles Arugal cast on them. Bring to me six enchanted Pyrewood Shackles
column3: <name>.

column1: Call of Water^20^Horde^Shaman^Tiev Mordune^Minor Manifestation of Water^Call of Water^^^Speak to the Minor Manifestation of Water at North Tide's Run in Silverpine Forest.^Light explodes as you finish the incantation. The sounds of the water drops hitting the flame have died down and your senses are overcome as the corrupt spirits around you are destroyed.
The Totem of Infliction^25^Alliance^Duskwood^Madame Eva^Madame Eva^^^^Bring 10 Ghoul Fangs
column2: 10 Skeleton Fingers and 5 Vials of Spider Venom to Madame Eva in Darkshire.^As the mystical taint creeps through the forest
column3: the need for self-protection is undeniable
column4: <name>. The winds whisper to me and they speak of a great danger which waits patiently for you in the near future. If you wish to protect yourself
column5: noble <class>
column6: bring to me 10 ghoul fangs
column7: 10 skeleton fingers and 5 vials of spider venom. For you I shall enchant a Totem of Infliction which will harm those who attempt violent acts against you.

column1: Patrolling Westfall^14^Alliance^Westfall^Captain Danuvin^Captain Danuvin^^^^Bring 8 Gnoll Paws to Captain Danuvin on Sentinel Hill.^Stormwind has abandoned us. A foul wind of depravity rustles through the plains of Westfall. This was my homeland and I will not turn my back on the citizens who choose to remain here. We
column2: the former farmers
column3: shall make our stand. Your task
column4: should you choose to accept
column5: is to patrol the grasslands of Westfall. Track down and slay the vile Gnolls that seem to be working in conjunction with the Deadmines thieves. Bring me eight Gnoll Paws and I will reward your bravery.

column1: Keeper of the Flame^16^All^Westfall^Captain Grayson^Captain Grayson^^^^Bring 5 Flasks of Oil to Captain Grayson at the Westfall Lighthouse.^The night the Lighthouse Keeper's family died was horrible. I watched
column2: helpless
column3: as Old Murk-Eye led the attack. But what's done is done and now my concern is for the lives of the sailors on The Great Sea whose ships come close to the perilous rocks of the coastline. With no one to keep watch on the flame the responsibility has fallen upon me. Help me keep the torch lit by bringing me 5 flasks of oil from the Harvest Monsters.

column1: The Coastal Menace^20^All^Westfall^Captain Grayson^Captain Grayson^^^^Bring a scale of Old Murk-Eye to Captain Grayson at the Westfall Lighthouse.^When my life was ended upon the rocks
column2: I had no clue what the afterlife held for me. The Lighthouse was black that night because Old Murk-Eye had scared the keeper's family off. They returned and re-lit the flame but Old Murk-Eye coerced the weaker minded murlocs to raid the Lighthouse with him once again. The second time the family was not so lucky and before my eyes they perished helplessly. Slay Old Murk-Eye if you see him along the shore and bring me one of his scales and I shall reward you.

column1: Alas
column2: Andorhal^60^Horde^Western Plaguelands^High Executor Derrington^High Executor Derrington^^All Along the Watchtowers^^Bring Araj's Phylactery Shard to High Executor Derrington at the Bulwark
column3: Western Plaguelands.^Alas
column4: the time to attack Andorhal and drive out the lich that controls it is upon us! Inside the ruins of the city is where the lich - Araj the Summoner - holds dominion. He is guarded by numerous Scourge surrounding the remains of city's center
column5: and his personal retinue of guardians attached to him directly is formidable. You will need numerous allies to even stand a chance of facing him successfully. Destroy Araj
column6: <name>
column7: and bring me a shard from his phylactery as proof!

column1: Young Lovers^6^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Maybell Maclure^Tommy Joe Stonefield^Young Lovers^^^Give Maybell's Love Letter to Tommy Joe Stonefield.^Oh
column2: I'm cursed! My heart belongs to Tommy Joe Stonefield
column3: but our families are bitter enemies. So I can't see him
column4: even though my eyes ache to gaze upon that handsome face! Please
column5: take this letter and give it to Tommy Joe. He's usually at the river to the west of the Stonefield Farm
column6: which is due west of here.

column1: Note to William^6^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Gramma Stonefield^William Pestle^Young Lovers^^^Take Gramma Stonefield's Note to William Pestle.^I bet William Pestle has a potion to unite our two young lovers! Here
column2: take this note to William. He's staying at the Lion's Pride Inn in Goldshire.

column1: Report to Gryan Stoutmantle^10^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Farmer Saldean^Gryan Stoutmantle^^^^Talk to Gryan Stoutmantle. He usually can be found in the stone tower on Sentinel Hill
column2: just off the road
column3: in the middle of Westfall.^Looks to me you've seen quite a bit of combat in your time
column4: <class>. If you haven't already
column5: you should report to Gryan Stoutmantle. He heads up the People's Militia
column6: aimed at protecting the farmlands of Westfall. I bet he could use your help. You can usually find him in the stone tower on Sentinel Hill
column7: just off the road in the middle of Westfall.

column1: Insect Part Analysis^48^All^Tanaris^Senior Surveyor Fizzledowser^Alchemist Pestlezugg^The Scrimshank Redemption^^^Check in Gadgetzan for Alchemist Pestlezugg and his analysis of the insect parts.^I'm going to spend some time taking a look at Scrimshank's surveying gear... as well as putting his personal effects in order. I get the sneaking feeling behind my ears that this isn't the last loss we'll be facing against these bugs. I'd like for you to check in with Alchemist Pestlezugg to see if he has had a chance to process the insect parts we sent him. If they're ready
column2: bring them to me.

column1: Speak with Gramma^6^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Tommy Joe Stonefield^Gramma Stonefield^Young Lovers^^^Speak with Gramma Stonefield.^Please
column2: <name>
column3: talk with my Gramma. If anyone can find a way to bring me together with Maybell
column4: she can. She's inside our house east of here.

column1: Collecting Kelp^7^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^William Pestle^William Pestle^Young Lovers^^The Escape^Bring 4 Crystal Kelp Fronds to William Pestle in Goldshire.^I can make an invisibility liquor for Maybell
column2: so she can slip away from the Maclure Vineyards and go to Tommy Joe. But to make the Liquor
column3: I need some crystal kelp. Although the kelp usually grows in the ocean... sometimes murlocs collect it. See if the murlocs near Crystal Lake have any. Crystal Lake is just east of Goldshire.

column1: Insect Part Analysis^48^All^Tanaris^Alchemist Pestlezugg^Senior Surveyor Fizzledowser^The Scrimshank Redemption^^Rise of the Silithid
column2: Rise of the Silithid^Deliver the report to Senior Surveyor Fizzledowser in Gadgetzan. Be sure he gives you a copy of the report
column3: as Alchemist Pestlezugg has requested.^Senior Surveyor Fizzledowser needs to see this report immediately. Actually... everyone who can read needs to see this report. We are facing a grave and serious threat to not only Tanaris and Gadgetzan
column4: but if left unchecked
column5: the entirety of southern Kalimdor. Heck
column6: even quite possible the whole of Azeroth; this thing has given no indication it will subside. Have Fizzledowser make a duplicate of the report for you to distribute freely to your allegiance. Everyone must know about this threat!

column1: The Escape^7^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^William Pestle^Maybell Maclure^^Collecting Kelp^^Take the Invisibility Liquor to Maybell Maclure.^Take this invisibility liquor to young Maybell. It should last long enough for her to visit Tommy Joe.

Shadow Magic^23^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Marshal Marris^Marshal Marris^^Blackrock Menace^^Bring 3 Midnight Orbs to Marshal Marris in Lakeshire.^The Blackrock orcs enlisted shadowcasters to aid their attacks in Redridge
column2: and they have brought with them devices of dark power--midnight orbs. These orbs have struck telling blows against Redridge's defenders
column3: and it's imperative we remove the demon-tainted items from the conflict. Find and deliver to me midnight orbs from slain Blackrock shadowcasters. I will then have them disposed of
column4: for this world would be a better place without them!

column1: Dry Times^15^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Barkeep Daniels^Barkeep Daniels^^^^Barkeep Daniels of Lakeshire needs a keg of Thunderbrew Lager
column2: a cask of Merlot
column3: a bottle of Moonshine and a skin of Sweet Rum.^I find myself in quite a pinch here
column4: <name>. The bottles are close to running dry. The latest booze shipment is long overdue. The orc invasion has been hell. Perhaps you can go to work for me? I need you to pick up a keg of Thunderbrew Lager from Grimbooze Thunderbrew in the Westfall hills
column5: a cask of Merlot from Stormwind
column6: a bottle of Moonshine from Darkshire and a skin of Sweet Rum from Goldshire. Bring those back to me and I will see to it you are rewarded.

column1: Thunderbrew Lager^15^Alliance^Westfall^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^^^^Bring Grimbooze Thunderbrew 5 hops to complete his special brew.^Hurry
column2: my friend
column3: move with hasteIn order for our rich lager to tasteMore like beer and less like stew
column4: Hops are needed to make the brew.

column1: The Price of Shoes^18^All^Redridge Mountains^Verner Osgood^Smith Argus^The Price of Shoes^^^Take Verner's Note to Smith Argus at Goldshire in Elwynn Forest.^I've been using so much iron keeping the Stormwind Guards outfitted
column2: I don't have enough to supply the stable's horses with shoes! Take this note to Blacksmith Argus in Goldshire. It explains to him my problem and requests a shipment of horseshoes.

column1: Return to Verner^18^All^Redridge Mountains^Smith Argus^Verner Osgood^The Price of Shoes^^Underbelly Scales
column2: A Baying of Gnolls^Return to Verner Osgood at Lakeshire in Redridge. Give him the Crate of Horseshoes.^Ok
column3: I'll give him his 50 horseshoes... Here they are
column4: all boxed up and ready to go! Tell Verner it was a pleasure doing business
column5: and be sure he reads the note attached to this crate!

column1: Messenger to Stormwind^14^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Magistrate Solomon^General Marcus Jonathan^Messenger to Stormwind^^^Magistrate Solomon has given you a report which must be delivered to General Marcus Jonathan in Stormwind. The judge wants you to return to him as soon as the delivery has been made.^These are trying times
column2: <class>. The township is under constant siege. Without reinforcements
column3: we will certainly face defeat. The message I now entrust to you is of utmost importance. Get this report to General Marcus Jonathan of Stormwind immediately. Once your delivery is made
column4: return to me at once with any news
column5: be it good or bad. Now make haste!

column1: Messenger to Stormwind^14^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^General Marcus Jonathan^Magistrate Solomon^Messenger to Stormwind^^Messenger to Westfall^Take General Marcus Jonathan's letter of response to Magistrate Solomon in Lakeshire.^While I wait for a response from the King I want you to carry this letter to Magistrate Solomon. Dismissed
column2: <class>!

column1: Underbelly Scales^18^All^Redridge Mountains^Verner Osgood^Verner Osgood^^Return to Verner^^Gather 6 Underbelly Whelp Scales from Black Dragon Whelps
column2: and bring them to Verner Osgood in Redridge.^I need some underbelly scales from black dragon whelps to pay for the shoes Argus sent me from Goldshire. If you can get 6 of them for me
column3: then I can pay Argus with some... and have enough left to fashion something for you. Black dragon whelps are often flying around south of Lakeshire
column4: but they like to wander. You might have to just keep an eye out and hunt them when you see them.

column1: The Collector^10^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Gold Pickup Schedule^Marshal Dughan^^^Manhunt^Go to Marshal Dughan in Goldshire and give him The Collector's Schedule.^This note is a schedule with a list of days and times when a person -- described only as "The Collector" -- will receive a shipment of gold from the mines in Elwynn Forest. From the schedule
column2: it looks as if the Collector resides near the Brackwell Pumpkin Patch in eastern Elwynn. This sounds important. You should report it to Marshal Dughan in Goldshire.

column1: A Baying of Gnolls^20^All^Redridge Mountains^Verner Osgood^Verner Osgood^A Baying of Gnolls^Return to Verner^^Kill 10 Redridge Brutes and 8 Redridge Mystics
column2: then return to Verner Osgood.^As if the attacking orcs weren't enough! Now I have gnoll brutes and mystics prowling along the ridge north of my stable
column3: taking my horses when they stray... If you can get rid of those gnolls
column4: my horses and I would be very grateful.

column1: The Lost Tools^16^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Foreman Oslow^Foreman Oslow^^^^Foreman Oslow of Lakeshire wants you to retrieve his toolbox from the bottom of Lake Everstill.^I could really use a hand here
column2: <name>. With the town under siege
column3: it's been hard to get supplies. My tools were being delivered from Goldshire by wagon but the bridge was blown out. We put the tools in a boat but the orcs hit it with a catapult. Just my luck
column4: my toolbox sank right to the bottom of the lake. Retrieve my toolbox
column5: <name>
column6: and I'll make it worth your while.

column1: Howling in the Hills^21^All^Redridge Mountains^Verner Osgood^Verner Osgood^A Baying of Gnolls^^^Bring Yowler's Paw to Verner Osgood in Lakeshire.^<name>
column2: the gnolls are still out there. I can hear their baying as they hunt in the hills above Lakeshire. And one cry is louder than the rest - Yowler
column3: their leader. Kill Yowler and send his pack scattering! Bring me his paw as proof. And be careful
column4: this gnoll is their leader for a reason. He is no Mongrel...

column1: Selling Fish^21^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Dockmaster Baren^Dockmaster Baren^^^^Bring 10 Spotted Sunfish to Dockmaster Baren in Lakeshire.^Lake Everstill is famous for its spotted sunfish. There's always demand for them...and I'm running low! Bring me a batch of 10 and I'll barter well for them. If you can't fish yourself
column2: then...maybe you can get them off the murlocs!

column1: Blackrock Bounty^25^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Guard Howe^Guard Howe^^^^Kill 15 Blackrock Champions and Guard Howe in Lakeshire will reward you.^The Blackrock Clan must be destroyed. The Enemy has invaded our lands. These mountains fall under the sovereign right of the King of Stormwind. Our sources tell us that the leaders of each unit within the Clan are known as Champions. You'll find them in their encampment to the north
column2: just west of the road to the Burning Steppes. Magistrate Solomon wants these foul brutes dead. Slay 15 Blackrock Champions and return to me.

column1: A Free Lunch^15^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Darcy^Guard Parker^A Free Lunch^^^Bring Parker's lunch to Guard Parker. He patrols the road leading to Darkshire.^Can you do me a favor? I've prepared a lunch for Guard Parker
column2: but he's out on patrol...he's a big
column3: strong Stormwind guard who can defend himself
column4: but it's much too dangerous out there for a townsperson like me. So if you deliver his lunch for me
column5: then come back here and I'll give you a free lunch! Parker patrols the stretch of road leading to Duskwood.

column1: Visit the Herbalist^15^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Guard Parker^Martie Jainrose^A Free Lunch^^^Speak with the Redridge Herbalist
column2: Martie Jainrose.^Before you go back to Darcy
column3: can you bring her some flowers for me? You can get them at the herbalist shop back in Lakeshire
column4: at the west end of town. But when you get the flowers...don't tell the herbalist
column5: Martie
column6: whom they're from
column7: or whom they're for...

column1: Delivering Daffodils^15^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Martie Jainrose^Darcy^A Free Lunch^^^Give Darcy the Daffodil Bouquet.^Here is your bouquet. I chose Daffodils for you. They're my favorite!

The Defias Brotherhood^18^Alliance^Westfall^Wiley the Black^Gryan Stoutmantle^The Defias Brotherhood^^^Take Wiley's Note to Gryan Stoutmantle in Westfall.^What I am about to tell you could cost me my life. The Defias gang is up to something big. Last I heard they were working in conjunction with various gnolls
column2: kobolds and even goblins. Take this note to Stoutmantle. It explains as much as I know on the subject.

column1: Ghoulish Effigy^27^Alliance^Duskwood^Abercrombie^Abercrombie^Supplies from Darkshire^^^Gather 7 Ghoul Ribs and bring them to Abercrombie at his shack.^I live so far from the protection of town
column2: it's a wonder the ghouls and the walking dead haven't eaten me! In fact
column3: just yesterday a pack of Bone Chewers was pounding on the walls of my house! I want to make an effigy - a kind of "scarecrow" for Ghouls. To do that I need some Ghoul Ribs. You can get them from Flesh Eaters
column4: Bone Chewers
column5: Brain Eaters
column6: Rotted Ones and Plague Spreaders. Get the ribs for me
column7: and I will repay you with some coin.

column1: Ogre Thieves^30^Alliance^Duskwood^Abercrombie^Abercrombie^Supplies from Darkshire^^^Return Abercrombie's Crate to Abercrombie.^A few weeks ago I was picking herbs far from my house
column2: and a band of ogres attacked me! I ran
column3: and I was forced to leave behind a crate of precious tools and herbs. After they chased me off
column4: the ogres swaggered back to the ogre mound in southern Duskwood. I'm sure my crate is somewhere near the mound. Please
column5: <name>
column6: retrieve this crate for me for I miss it sorely.

column1: The Defias Brotherhood^18^Alliance^Westfall^Gryan Stoutmantle^Master Mathias Shaw^The Defias Brotherhood^^^Take Wiley's Note to Mathias Shaw in Stormwind.^I wonder what Wiley meant when he mentioned the Stonemasons. Perhaps that was a slip of tongue. Could the Defias gang be related to the Stonemasons? Only one man would know for sure: Mathias Shaw
column2: head of SI:7. Show him Wiley's Note and see if he has anything to add to this growing mystery. If you have trouble finding Shaw
column3: check the Barracks in Old Town.

column1: Captain Sanders' Hidden Treasure^16^All^Westfall^Captain Sanders' Treasure Map^Captain's Footlocker^Captain Sanders' Hidden Treasure^^^Find Captain Sanders' footlocker and search it for the next clue.^If ye be readin' this
column2: it means that Ol' Captain Sanders is in a watery grave. So my treasure is yours now
column3: ye jest need to follow the clues. First ye need to find me footlocker. It's probably half-buried in sand by now
column4: along the Western Coast of Westfall near the shipwreck. There be lots of shipwrecks but only one rusty anchor on the coast. Find that anchor and you'll find me locker! Look in there for the next clue.

column1: Captain Sanders' Hidden Treasure^16^All^Westfall^Captain's Footlocker^Broken Barrel^Captain Sanders' Hidden Treasure^^^Find the old barrel near the ruined chimney and search it for your next clue.^The clue to the treasure reads: Good work
column2: matey! Now ye need to head due east. East up the bluffs
column3: east to the road. Look for the ol' chimney ruins near the side of the road. There you'll find an old barrel with your next clue.

column1: Captain Sanders' Hidden Treasure^16^All^Westfall^Broken Barrel^Old Jug^Captain Sanders' Hidden Treasure^^^Search the empty jug next to the windmill for the next clue.^Searching through the barrel you discover another piece of parchment. This one reads: Now from this here barrel
column2: face ye North. Straight as the crow flies
column3: keep ye walkin' till you see the empty jug next to the lone windmill on the sea bluffs. If ye poke around that jug
column4: ye just might find what you're lookin' for.

column1: Captain Sanders' Hidden Treasure^16^All^Westfall^Old Jug^Locked Chest^Captain Sanders' Hidden Treasure^^^Locate Captain Sanders' chest and open it for your reward.^Sure enough
column2: deep within the Old Jug there is another clue to Sanders' treasure. The ink has run in some places and the paper smells like whiskey but you can make out some of the text: Now that ye found me ol' whiskey jug
column3: you're almost to the treasure! Just face West from the bottle and walk down to the shore. Once ye get to the water
column4: keep going! Swim straight west till you find the island with me treasure chest!

column1: The Defias Brotherhood^18^Alliance^Westfall^Master Mathias Shaw^Gryan Stoutmantle^The Defias Brotherhood^^^Take Shaw's report to Gryan Stoutmantle in Westfall.^The Stonemasons' Guild was run by a man named Edwin VanCleef. VanCleef was responsible for rebuilding Stormwind after the orcs razed it in the First War. Apparently
column2: VanCleef and his men were unhappy with their treatment by the King after the reconstruction was complete. That just might explain a thing or two. I have written a more detailed account for your Master in Westfall. Take this to him at once!

column1: The Defias Brotherhood^18^Alliance^Westfall^Gryan Stoutmantle^Gryan Stoutmantle^The Defias Brotherhood^^The Defias Brotherhood^Track down the Defias Messenger in Westfall and bring his message to Stoutmantle.^We need to discover the location of the Defias hideout. <name>
column2: my scout reports that a Defias Messenger has been seen on the roads between Moonbrook
column3: the Gold Coast Quarry and the Jangolode Mine. I want you to capture him. If he resists
column4: kill him and bring me whatever he is carrying.

column1: Messenger to Westfall^14^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Magistrate Solomon^Gryan Stoutmantle^Messenger to Westfall^Messenger to Stormwind^^Magistrate Solomon wants you to take his written plea to Gryan Stoutmantle in Westfall.^Something odd is afoot with the Stormwind Army. They should have been here in force by now. Time is a luxury we don't have
column2: however. I will not stand by and watch the people of Lakeshire give their lives without trying to enlist more help. I've heard word of a people's militia forming in Westfall. Take this plea to their leader
column3: Gryan Stoutmantle. Perhaps Stoutmantle's men can lend some support here until the King sends reserves.

column1: Messenger to Westfall^14^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Gryan Stoutmantle^Magistrate Solomon^Messenger to Westfall^^Messenger to Darkshire^Return to Magistrate Solomon with Gryan Stoutmantle's response.^Magistrate Solomon's note pains me to read. But it is obvious he knows not the war which is waged in Westfall or else he would know better than to expect aid from the Militia. If Stormwind had not deserted us as well
column2: we would not have the need for the Militia. Take this response to your master in Redridge
column3: <class>. And let him know that my heart is heavy with the loss of good men.

column1: Messenger to Darkshire^18^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Magistrate Solomon^Lord Ello Ebonlocke^Messenger to Darkshire^Messenger to Westfall^^Magistrate Solomon wants you to take a letter to Lord Ebonlocke in Darkshire.^I require your assistance once again. I have written to Lord Ebonlocke
column2: requesting that he sends his trained guards
column3: the Night Watch
column4: to help with Lakeshire's defense. It is imperative this message makes it to him swiftly. You must exercise extreme caution. Ebonlocke is the mayor of Darkshire
column5: in the heart of Duskwood. Do not stray from the roads.

column1: Messenger to Darkshire^18^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Lord Ello Ebonlocke^Magistrate Solomon^Messenger to Darkshire^^^Return to Magistrate Solomon with Lord Ebonlocke's letter of response.^If I did not know Magistrate Solomon personally
column2: I would say the man has gone mad. Send the Night Watch to Lakeshire because Stormwind refuses aid? The Night Watch was formed because Stormwind left us when this foul magic seeped into the land. If I sent my Night Watch
column3: this town would be overrun by evil before the guards even reached the forest's edge. Take this letter of response to your Master in Lakeshire.

column1: Manhunt^10^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Marshal Dughan^Marshal Dughan^^The Collector^^Find and kill "the Collector" then return to Marshal Dughan with The Collector's Ring.^If the "Collector" is taking gold from our mines then he's stealing from the kingdom! Bring the Collector to justice
column2: and bring me the ring mentioned in the pickup schedule you gave me. It may tell us whom the Collector is working for... That Pickup Schedule says the Collector is hiding out at the Brackwell Pumpkin Patch. You should search for him there.

column1: Supplies from Darkshire^24^Alliance^Duskwood^Abercrombie^Madame Eva^Supplies from Darkshire^The Hermit^^Speak with Madame Eva.^Oh
column2: what is a poor old man to do? I need some supplies from Darkshire
column3: but the village is so far away and I am so old and feeble...I would never make the trip. Can you go to Darkshire and bring me back some Ghost Hair Thread? You can get it from Madame Eva at her home on the Darkshire square.

column1: Ghost Hair Thread^24^Alliance^Duskwood^Madame Eva^Blind Mary^Supplies from Darkshire^^^Bring the Spectral Comb to Blind Mary.^There is a poor
column2: sad spirit
column3: Blind Mary
column4: who haunts an old farm house in the hills south of Darkshire. Here
column5: take this Spectral Comb and ask Blind Mary to comb her hair. Then bring back the comb and I will glean from it the Ghost Hair I'll need for the thread. And take care
column6: for dark things now lurk near that house...

column1: Murloc Poachers^20^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Dockmaster Baren^Dockmaster Baren^^^^Bring 8 Murloc Fins to Dockmaster Baren in Lakeshire.^Murlocs are becoming a problem. Larger groups of the fishmen are dropping anchor along the shores of Lake Everstill and fishing up a storm! We need them gone before they eat all the fish in the lake! Hunt murlocs! Bring me eight of their fins and I might have something for you...

Poor Old Blanchy^14^Alliance^Westfall^Verna Furlbrow^Verna Furlbrow^^^^Verna Furlbrow in Westfall wants you to bring her 8 Handfuls of Oats.^Poor Old Blanchy! Such a tired beast after all the work we put her through. I fed her before we left the farm
column2: but we weren't expecting the wagon to break on us. If you could bring her a few handfuls of oats from the fields
column3: I'd be grateful. I bet you could find some around all of the farms in Westfall
column4: if you can steer clear of those horrific machines that have taken over. There are several farms southwest of here.

column1: The Coast Isn't Clear^19^All^Westfall^Captain Grayson^Captain Grayson^^^^Kill 7 Tidehunters
column2: 7 Warriors
column3: 7 Oracles and 7 Coastrunners and return to Captain Grayson at the Westfall Lighthouse.^You probably noticed all of the shipwrecks along the coast. The Great Sea is treacherous indeed. The coast of Westfall needs to be kept clear
column4: so that if sailors find their way to our beaches
column5: they are safe. The Murlocs are trouble though. Kill 7 Tidehunters
column6: 7 Warriors
column7: 7 Oracles and 7 Coastrunners and I will see to it that you are rewarded.

column1: Red Leather Bandanas^15^Alliance^Westfall^Scout Galiaan^Scout Galiaan^^^^Bring 15 Red Leather Bandanas to Scout Galiaan at Sentinel Hill.^The Defias Front is constantly shifting. I've been following their movements for quite some time now. On a side note
column2: I've ascertained that many members of the gang can be tracked by the Red Leather Bandanas they wear. Bring me 15 of these Bandanas and I'll see to it you are rewarded.

column1: Return the Comb^24^Alliance^Duskwood^Blind Mary^Madame Eva^Supplies from Darkshire^^^Return the Ghost Hair Comb to Madame Eva in Darkshire.^NO!!!!! Take it
column2: take this comb away from me! I'm a monster
column3: and no one will ever think me lovely again!

column1: The Defias Brotherhood^18^Alliance^Westfall^The Defias Traitor^Gryan Stoutmantle^The Defias Brotherhood^The Defias Brotherhood^Red Silk Bandanas^Escort the Defias Traitor to the secret hideout of the Defias Brotherhood. Once the Defias Traitor shows you where VanCleef and his men are hiding out
column2: return to Gryan Stoutmantle with the information.^So Stoutmantle sends a scrawny <race> like you to protect me? Guess you'll have to do. Better bring some friends too. You know the deal
column3: right? You watch my back and I'll take you to the Defias hideout. But you better be close by my side. The Defias gang wants my head now. If they see me with you
column4: they'll try to kill me. Let me know when you and any friends you can round up are ready to go.

column1: Gather Rot Blossoms^24^Alliance^Duskwood^Tavernkeep Smitts^Tavernkeep Smitts^Supplies from Darkshire^^^Gather 8 Rot Blossoms and bring them to Tavernkeep Smitts in Darkshire.^If you bring me some rot blossoms then I can brew you up a batch of zombie juice. Rot blossoms grow in strange places. In particular
column2: I hear you can find them inside the skulls of Skeletal Horrors and Skeletal Fiends... not that I've gotten close enough to look! The Raven Hill Cemetery is lousy with those skeletons. You may as well get rid of them while you're looking for rot blossoms. The town of Darkshire would be grateful.

column1: Deliver the Thread^24^Alliance^Duskwood^Madame Eva^Abercrombie^Supplies from Darkshire^^^Bring the Ghost Hair Thread to Abercrombie
column2: in his shack north of the Raven Hill Cemetery.^Here is your thread
column3: <name>. It has a thousand uses
column4: from binding evil spirits to sewing life into inanimate objects.

column1: Zombie Juice^24^Alliance^Duskwood^Abercrombie^Tavernkeep Smitts^Supplies from Darkshire^^^Speak with Tavernkeep Smitts.^I need a bottle of a certain liquor - Zombie Juice. Tavernkeep Smitts at the Scarlet Raven Tavern in Darkshire should have some. And please hurry
column2: <name>. These nights get cold
