column3: and I need that drink to put fire in my veins again!

column1: Juice Delivery^24^Alliance^Duskwood^Tavernkeep Smitts^Abercrombie^Supplies from Darkshire^^^Bring the Zombie Juice to Abercrombie at his shack.^Here's your Zombie Juice... ...and be careful with this stuff. It's strong enough to raise the dead!
Note to the Mayor^30^Alliance^Duskwood^Abercrombie^Lord Ello Ebonlocke^Supplies from Darkshire^^^Bring Abercrombie's Letter to Ello Ebonlocke
column2: Mayor of Darkshire.^Take this note to Ello Ebonlocke
column3: the Mayor of Darkshire. He and I are old friends...and when he reads it and discovers what you did for me...I'm sure he'll be just as happy as I am! Hahahaha!

column1: A Dark Threat Looms^18^Alliance^Loch Modan^Chief Engineer Hinderweir VII^Ashlan Stonesmirk^A Dark Threat Looms^^^Chief Engineer Hinderweir wants you to take the strange smelling powder to Ashlan Stonesmirk
column2: the explosives expert at Dun Modr in the Wetlands.^If my suspicions are correct
column3: this is some type of explosive powder. This must be analyzed by an explosives expert so we know just what we're dealing with here. Ashlan Stonesmirk was assigned to the regiment guarding Dun Modr and the Thandol Span. I need you to make a grave and perilous journey
column4: <name>. Travel through the Algaz Gate
column5: follow the road through the Wetlands and seek out Stonesmirk in Dun Modr. Heed my advice: stick to the roads and stop for nothing!

column1: Rise of the Silithid^49^Alliance^Tanaris^Senior Surveyor Fizzledowser^Gracina Spiritmight^^Insect Part Analysis^^Take the Insect Analysis Report to Gracina Spiritmight in Darnassus.^I urge you to take this report to someone who has working knowledge in this kind of thing. I know this night elf scholar named Gracina Spiritmight. She's spent a lot of time studying life forms that are unique to the ecology of Azeroth; she's a historian to boot! If you want someone to help figure out what exactly this threat is
column2: and more importantly how to stop it
column3: give her the report. We'll need the help. Last I heard
column4: she was residing in the Temple of the Moon
column5: located in Darnassus.

column1: Raven Hill^20^Alliance^Duskwood^Elaine Carevin^Jitters^^^Jitters' Growling Gut^Find out what is haunting Raven Hill.^Something's amiss at Raven Hill
column2: <name>. Calor swears that someone--or something--is haunting the buildings there. Two nights running he's noticed the shadows moving
column3: and the third before that he says he saw light in one of the windows. If
column4: as you say
column5: you care about the safety of Duskwood
column6: find out what monster haunts in Raven Hill.

column1: Deliveries to Sven^23^Alliance^Duskwood^Elaine Carevin^Sven Yorgen^^^^Deliver the supplies to Sven.^Do you know Sven? Now
column2: there is a man who does the work of the Light! He and his followers keep a camp at the northwestern edge of Duskwood. Unfortunately
column3: because they are so few
column4: they cannot even spare a man to fetch supplies from town. Will you deliver these supplies to him?

column1: The Hermit^25^Alliance^Duskwood^Elaine Carevin^Abercrombie^^^Supplies from Darkshire^Check on the old man in the shack near Raven Hill cemetery.^There was an old man who used to come into town to buy supplies rather frequently
column2: but I haven't seen him for quite some time now. He lives out in a shack overlooking Raven Hill cemetery
column3: if I remember correctly. Perhaps you should go see if something is amiss.

column1: The Defias Brotherhood^22^Alliance^The Deadmines^Gryan Stoutmantle^Gryan Stoutmantle^The Defias Brotherhood^^^Kill Edwin VanCleef and bring his head to Gryan Stoutmantle.^There is but one task left for you to complete. Edwin VanCleef must be assassinated. While it saddens me to condemn any man to a death sentence
column2: it is for the greater good of the people of Westfall that VanCleef is laid to rest once and for all. Bring me the villain's head once the deed is done.

column1: Oh Brother. . .^20^Alliance^The Deadmines^Wilder Thistlenettle^Wilder Thistlenettle^^^^Bring Foreman Thistlenettle's Explorers' League Badge to Wilder Thistlenettle in Stormwind.^We were deep in a vast mine in Westfall
column2: hidden beneath a barn in Moonbrook. No clue where these stinkin' thieving types came from. Anyway
column3: the mine tunnel collapsed on us. I got out but the others... well... the others haven't been heard from. You look like you might have better luck in there. If you could look for my brother
column4: I'd be thankful. He always carried his Explorers' League Badge. If you can't find him
column5: that badge would at least give me some peace of mind.

column1: Collecting Memories^18^Alliance^The Deadmines^Wilder Thistlenettle^Wilder Thistlenettle^^^^Retrieve 4 Miners' Union Cards and return them to Wilder Thistlenettle in Stormwind.^Many of my friends perished that horrible day when the mine tunnel caved in. If your adventures happen to bring you into that wing of the mine in Moonbrook
column2: please keep an eye out for any sign which might identify them. If you come across any of their Miners' Union Cards
column3: bring them back to me and I'll make sure their families get some resolution from this horrible accident.

column1: Wanted: Gath'Ilzogg^26^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Wanted: Gath'Ilzogg^Magistrate Solomon^^^^Kill Gath'Ilzogg and bring his head to Magistrate Solomon in Lakeshire for the reward.^Wanted! Gath'Ilzogg
column2: Leader of the Blackrock attacks on Stonewatch Keep and raids against the township of Lakeshire. Gath'Ilzogg is extremely dangerous. He is reportedly holed up in the recently conquered keep plotting the Blackrock clan's further crimes against humanity. The orc infestation must be quelled at all costs. A gracious reward will be given to whatever brave soul can deliver the head of Gath'Ilzogg to Magistrate Solomon.

column1: A New Threat^2^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Balir Frosthammer^Balir Frosthammer^^Dwarven Outfitters^^Balir Frosthammer wants you to kill 6 Rockjaw Troggs and 6 Burly Rockjaw Troggs.^I hope you're here to lend us a hand
column2: <class>. After the last trogg attack
column3: we could use all the help we can get. I hear the buggers have been popping up all across the lands
column4: and it seems Coldridge Valley is no exception. They've been spotted all over the hills to the southeast and near the frozen lake. And that's not all
column5: just a few nights ago
column6: they attacked and overran our camp to the west! We're a bit shorthanded here
column7: <lad /lass>
column8: and we need strong arms to help drive the troggs back.

column1: Worgen in the Woods^28^Alliance^Duskwood^Calor^Calor^Worgen in the Woods^^^Kill 6 Nightbane Shadow Weaver worgen for Calor in Darkshire.^Darkness seems drawn inexorably to Duskwood. Master Carevin's quest is the expulsion of evil and heresy. Through our efforts are the people of Darkshire kept safe. You believe yourself worthy to join us? I once thought as you. Disillusioned by the complacency of the Watch
column2: I joined Master Carevin. If you wish to prove yourself
column3: it will not be through words. Test your skills against the Nightbane Shadow Weaver worgen in Brightwood Grove--bright
column4: hah!--and the Rotting Orchard.

column1: Look To The Stars^25^Alliance^Duskwood^Viktori Prism'Antras^Viktori Prism'Antras^Look To The Stars^^^Viktori Prism'Antras of Darkshire wants you to bring him a bronze tube.^My Gnomish friend
column2: Cog
column3: has promised to help me build a device which will let me peer towards the stars. A truth exists
column4: beyond magic
column5: that can explain the strange transformation in the forest. Bring to me a bronze tube made by a skilled engineer. That is the first step
column6: according to Cog's blueprint.

column1: Look To The Stars^25^Alliance^Duskwood^Viktori Prism'Antras^Blind Mary^Look To The Stars^^^Locate Mary and persuade her to give up a reflective surface for Viktori's project.^According to Cog's blueprint
column2: what I need now is a way to reflect light. I remember a woman by the name of Mary who became well known around these parts for always carrying a looking glass. Perhaps you can track Mary down and see if she might lend us a reflective surface for this project? I believe she once resided in southern Duskwood. . .

column1: Wanted: "Hogger"^11^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Wanted Poster^Marshal Dughan^^^^Slay the gnoll Hogger and bring his Huge Gnoll Claw to Marshal Dughan.^Wanted: Hogger A huge gnoll
column2: Hogger
column3: is prowling the woods in southwestern Elwynn. He has overpowered all attempts at his capture. The Stormwind Army has placed a generous bounty on the Gnoll. To earn the reward
column4: bounty hunters should bring proof of Hogger's demise to Marshal Dughan in Goldshire.

column1: Look To The Stars^25^Alliance^Duskwood^Blind Mary^Viktori Prism'Antras^Look To The Stars^^^Retrieve Blind Mary's Looking Glass from the Insane Ghoul and give it to Viktori in Darkshire.^The looking glass was one of my finest treasures until. . .the incident. After that happened
column2: I discarded it behind the barn. There was an Insane Ghoul who used to roam back there. Perhaps he picked it up. Rumor has it the devilish beast resides in the Tranquil Gardens Cemetery.

column1: Theocritus' Retrieval^23^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Glowing Shadowhide Pendant^Theocritus^^^^Bring the Faded Shadowhide Pendant to Theocritus the Mage at the Tower of Azora in Elwynn Forest.^<You hear a disembodied voice...> Do not be alarmed. I am Theocritus
column2: High Mage of Tower Azora in Elwynn Forest. The pendant you are holding is a method of communication between the Shadowhide Gnolls and their master
column3: Morganth. Through months of research
column4: I believe I too can communicate through these pendants. If you can hear this message
column5: then my spell was a success. Bring me this pendant and I will reward you for the service.

column1: Dwarven Outfitters^1^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Sten Stoutarm^Sten Stoutarm^^^A New Threat
column2: Coldridge Valley Mail Delivery
column3: Simple Rune
column4: Consecrated Rune
column5: Etched Rune
column6: Encrypted Rune
column7: Hallowed Rune
column8: Simple Memorandum
column9: Encrypted Memorandum
column10: Glyphic Memorandum
column11: Tainted Memorandum^Sten Stoutarm would like 8 pieces of Tough Wolf Meat.^What do we have here? You look as though you might need something to keep your hands warm
column12: hm? I'll tell you what would help: a pair of nice
column13: warm gloves. And
column14: being the kind soul that I am
column15: I'd be more than happy to provide you with a suitable pair. I've one condition
column16: however. I need you to go get me some wolf meat. Nice arrangement
column17: hm? You bring me some wolf meat
column18: and I'll make sure you don't lose any digits to frostbite. Well

column1: Wanted: Lieutenant Fangore^26^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Wanted: Lieutenant Fangore^Magistrate Solomon^^^^Kill Lieutenant Fangore and return to Magistrate Solomon in Lakeshire with his paw.^Wanted: Lieutenant Fangore Known leader of the Shadowhide Gnoll Clan
column2: working under the enemy of the Township and Kingdom
column3: Morganth. By mandate of Magistrate Solomon
column4: this vile betrayer of Stormwind is wanted dead. Show his paw to the Magistrate as proof of his death.

column1: Look To The Stars^30^Alliance^Duskwood^Viktori Prism'Antras^Viktori Prism'Antras^Look To The Stars^^^Locate Zzarc'Vul in the southern ogre mound in Duskwood and return his monocle to Viktori in Darkshire.^Now there is just one more item needed to complete this device. Cog's blueprint calls for a lens of some sort. The only lens I know of that would be large enough will be very difficult to acquire. There is an ogre by the name of Zzarc'Vul who resides in the mound in southern Duskwood. If you can
column2: bring to me his monocle and I will use that as our lens!

column1: The Troll Cave^4^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Grelin Whitebeard^Grelin Whitebeard^The Troll Cave^^^Grelin Whitebeard would like you to kill 10 Frostmane Troll Whelps.^My brother Senir and I were sent to different parts of Dun Morogh to investigate the threat posed by the trolls. The Senate has its hands full with the troggs
column2: so they've no need for further annoyances. From what I've seen
column3: the trolls aren't well situated here in Coldridge Valley--mostly the southern cave. I'd say that the army will not be necessary. A few strong arms should be more than enough. Perhaps you'd like to assist in this endeavor? I have the authority to offer compensation for your help.

column1: The Boar Hunter^3^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Talin Keeneye^Talin Keeneye^^^^Talin Keeneye would like you to kill 8 Small Crag Boars.^Nothing like a day of boar hunting
column2: eh? Though
column3: here in Coldridge Valley
column4: there are so many boars it almost takes the fun out of it. No need to get them charging. They're all angry and ready without any help. In fact
column5: recently
column6: there've been so many boars in the area
column7: it's become dangerous for me to do my daily hunting. Long story short
column8: if you could help me kill some of the boars
column9: I would appreciate it.

column1: Furlbrow's Deed^9^Alliance^Westfall^Westfall Deed^Farmer Furlbrow^^^^Bring Furlbrow's Deed to Farmer Furlbrow.^This is the deed to an expanse of farmlands within Westfall. It is signed by a Theodore Furlbrow and cosigned by his wife
column2: Verna. And on the back of the deed are hastily scrawled words: "We leaned on Furlbrow and got his deed. Thought it might be handy if you wanted to forge one of these for your own place. The Furlbrows won't give us trouble. Last I saw them they were on their way out of Westfall
column3: stuck with a broken wagon." You think the Furlbrows might want their deed back...

column1: Tiger Mastery^31^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Ajeck Rouack^Ajeck Rouack^Tiger Mastery^Welcome to the Jungle^^Ajeck Rouack of Nesingwary's Expedition wants you to kill 10 Young Stranglethorn Tigers.^When I was but a young girl
column2: my father trained me in the art of tiger hunting. You'll find the young felines much easier to track and slay. For this reason
column3: we'll start you out easy. One can often find young tigers near the expedition camp. Test your tracking skills and see if you can hunt some of the beasts down.

column1: Tiger Mastery^33^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Ajeck Rouack^Ajeck Rouack^Tiger Mastery^^^Ajeck Rouack of Nesingwary's Expedition wants you to kill 10 Stranglethorn Tigers.^You are learning
column2: <class>. Let us test your skills with the mature cats now. Kill 10 Stranglethorn Tigers this time out.

column1: Tiger Mastery^35^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Ajeck Rouack^Ajeck Rouack^Tiger Mastery^^^Ajeck Rouack of Nesingwary's Expedition wants you to kill 10 Elder Stranglethorn Tigers.^Now I'm going to up the stakes on you and truly test your skill. Prove to me you can kill 10 Elder Stranglethorn Tigers. If you can do that
column2: you will be ready for your final challenge before I declare you a master tiger hunter in Master Nesingwary's presence. Elder Stranglethorn Tigers are not only the most difficult to find
column3: they are also the fiercest to defeat.

column1: Tiger Mastery^37^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Ajeck Rouack^Ajeck Rouack^Tiger Mastery^^Big Game Hunter^Ajeck Rouack of Nesingwary's Expedition wants you to kill Sin'Dall and return with her paw.^Here is the final challenge that I will put forth. We've been tracking an elusive tiger for weeks. We call the beast Sin'Dall. See if you can do what no <race> has done before: hunt down and kill Sin'Dall. Bring me her paw as proof of your accomplishment. Tracking her down will be no easy task.

Bloodscalp Ears^35^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Kebok^Kebok^^^Skullsplitter Tusks^Acquire 15 Bloodscalp Ears and return them to Kebok in Booty Bay.^Damn trolls! They've been killing off our agents in the jungle! I've already lost a good number of my best guards to skirmishes with them. The costs are piling up! How will I explain this to Baron Revilgaz? Decisive action... Think
column2: Kebok... you weren't assigned to the post you have today for sitting around... I've got it! You... <name>
column3: is it? You'll help me
column4: won't you? There's money to be had! Here's the deal... you bring me the ears of fifteen Bloodscalp Trolls
column5: and I'll compensate you well.

column1: Panther Mastery^31^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Sir S. J. Erlgadin^Sir S. J. Erlgadin^Panther Mastery^Welcome to the Jungle^^Sir S. J. Erlgadin of Nesingwary's Expedition wants you to kill 10 Young Panthers.^If you want to be a part of the hunt with this crack group under Hemet Jr.'s leadership
column2: you're going to need to prove yourself an able panther hunter. We'll start you out easy -- don't you worry. Let's see you kill 10 young panthers to start. Tracking them down is only half the challenge...

column1: Panther Mastery^33^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Sir S. J. Erlgadin^Sir S. J. Erlgadin^Panther Mastery^^^Sir S. J. Erlgadin of Nesingwary's Expedition wants you to kill 10 Panthers.^Now you're ready to turn it up a notch. If you want to prove yourself worthy of socializing with the likes of these big game hunters
column2: you'll need to prove that you can kill 10 panthers. Those big boys are tougher. They're not as easy as the young ones you were killing earlier.

column1: Panther Mastery^38^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Sir S. J. Erlgadin^Sir S. J. Erlgadin^Panther Mastery^^^Sir S. J. Erlgadin of Nesingwary's Expedition wants you to kill 10 Shadowmaw Panthers.^Now the hard part. A true panther hunter can show skill by dropping Shadowmaw Panthers
column2: the deadliest in Stranglethorn. Prove to us that you can slay 10 of these beasts. If you think they are hard to track
column3: wait until you attempt to slay one....

column1: Panther Mastery^40^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Sir S. J. Erlgadin^Sir S. J. Erlgadin^Panther Mastery^^Big Game Hunter^Sir S. J. Erlgadin of Nesingwary's Expedition wants you to bring him the Fang of Bhag'thera.^You've almost proven yourself to be a master hunter of panthers. A panther by the name of Bhag'thera has been prowling the jungle. So far he's eluded our party. See if you can use your skills to kill the great Bhag'thera. Bring me the Fang of Bhag'thera and you'll have earned my respect!

Raptor Mastery^34^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Hemet Nesingwary Jr.^Hemet Nesingwary Jr.^Raptor Mastery^Welcome to the Jungle^^Hemet Nesingwary Jr. wants you to kill 10 Stranglethorn Raptors.^So you think your hunting skills are in tip-top shape? I can put them to the test in a jiffy. Head out into that jungle and kill 10 Stranglethorn Raptors. We'll see just how much of a big game hunter you are. And no
column2: I won't tell you where you can find them! Locating the beasts is half the challenge.

column1: Raptor Mastery^36^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Hemet Nesingwary Jr.^Hemet Nesingwary Jr.^Raptor Mastery^^^Hemet Nesingwary Jr. wants you to kill 10 Lashtail Raptors.^Now let's step up the challenge and see if you're up to it. Venture into the jungle and bag yourself 10 of those bloody Lashtail Raptors. Let's see what you've got!

Raptor Mastery^41^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Hemet Nesingwary Jr.^Hemet Nesingwary Jr.^Raptor Mastery^^^Hemet Nesingwary Jr. wants you to kill 10 Jungle Stalkers.^Let's see how you handle this next challenge. There is a cagey breed of raptor out there. We call them Jungle Stalkers. They are far more difficult to track down and kill than the other breeds you've been trying your luck at. Kill 10 Jungle Stalkers and I'll tip you off to the best hunting yet.
Raptor Mastery^43^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Hemet Nesingwary Jr.^Hemet Nesingwary Jr.^Raptor Mastery^^Big Game Hunter^Hemet Nesingwary Jr. wants you to kill Tethis
column2: an elusive
column3: dangerous raptor in Stranglethorn.^Because you proved yourself to be such a go-getter in the jungle
column4: let me tell you about a ferocious raptor that even I have failed to kill. Ajeck here calls this wily raptor Tethis. If you want to prove yourself a true master
column5: kill Tethis and bring me his talon. It would be a feat that no other big game hunter has accomplished.

column1: Supplies to Private Thorsen^32^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Krazek^Private Thorsen^^^^Deliver the Miscellaneous Goblin Supplies to Private Thorsen.^Hmm. Yes
column2: I do have something you could do
column3: actually. Lieutenant Doren and his followers up in the north need their regular supplies from us. They haven't been delivered
column4: and with the trolls attacking
column5: I'll need someone to do it. Doren's camp lies northwest of the road at the entrance to Stranglethorn from Duskwood. Give the supplies to Private Thorsen
column6: if he's not in the camp
column7: then he'll be patrolling south of it. He'll take care of them. Mind you
column8: if you fail
column9: you'll owe me restitution.

column1: A Dark Threat Looms^18^Alliance^Loch Modan^Suspicious Barrel^Chief Engineer Hinderweir VII^A Dark Threat Looms^^^Return to Chief Engineer Hinderweir and show him the clue that you discovered.^You take a sample of the strange smelling powder.
Bookie Herod^35^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Lieutenant Doren^Bookie Herod's Records^Jungle Secrets^^^Find Bookie Herod's Records.^If Kurzen knows Thorsen's secret
column2: then we have a spy in our midst. We must determine how the secret was leaked! Thorsen's contact within Kurzen's camp was Bookie Herod. Herod is Kurzen's logistics officer and knows everything about the running of Kurzen's Compound. If you can get Herod's notes or records
column3: maybe we can find out how Thorsen was discovered. When we were still with Kurzen
column4: Bookie's office was on the top floor of the camp's only two-story house. His records are probably still there.

column1: Investigate the Camp^32^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Krazek^Krazek^^^^Find the hunters' camp and report its location to Krazek in Booty Bay.^I've gotten reports of a group of hunters that have set up camp upriver of the Venture Company mining camp on Lake Nazferiti. Now
column2: normally I wouldn't care
column3: but improbably
column4: I heard that Hemet Nesingwary Jr. was one of the hunters there. He's certainly well-connected
column5: if you catch my meaning
column6: and you never can be too safe. Why don't you go check out the camp
column7: <name>
column8: see what they're about?

column1: Colonel Kurzen^40^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Lieutenant Doren^Lieutenant Doren^Special Forces^^Kurzen's Mystery^Kill 6 Kurzen Elite
column2: 4 Kurzen Subchiefs
column3: and bring Kurzen's Head to Lieutenant Doren at the Rebel Camp.^You have proven yourself time and again
column4: and your resourcefulness seems to rival even that of Kurzen himself. You may be the salvation of our band of rebels...if you can pit yourself against Kurzen and prevail! He commands his men from deep within the Stockpile. You must enter that cave
column5: brave through his defenders
column6: and face Kurzen and his leaders. Farewell
column7: <name>. My hope
column8: and the fate of my men
column9: go with you.

column1: The Second Rebellion^33^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Sergeant Yohwa^Sergeant Yohwa^^^Special Forces^Kill 15 Kurzen Jungle Fighters.^We're fighting a losing battle with Colonel Kurzen. Not only is he a brilliant tactician
column2: he outnumbers us at least 10 to 1! To survive
column3: we need to use his own
column4: covert tactics against him. Enter his camp to the east and kill his men. Lots of them. And get out before reinforcements can close on you.

column1: Bad Medicine^34^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Sergeant Yohwa^Sergeant Yohwa^^^Special Forces^Bring 7 Jungle Remedies and 1 Venom Fern Extract to Sergeant Yohwa at the Rebel Camp.^To have a chance against Kurzen
column2: we need his healing support neutralized. He has gathered a large number of medicine men who heal his forces with jungle remedies and poison our fighters with venom fern extracts. We need those remedies and extracts for our own. Search the Kurzen Compound - his medicine men and jungle fighters will have the remedies
column3: and the extracts are probably stowed in some of the camp's supply boxes.

column1: Troll Witchery^40^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Brother Nimetz^Brother Nimetz^Kurzen's Mystery^^Mai'Zoth^Bring 4 Skullsplitter Fetishes to Brother Nimetz at the Rebel Camp.^While I study those legends you acquired
column2: gather for me implements of evil troll magic. Enter the territory of the Skullsplitter trolls
column3: a second tribe to the distant south
column4: and acquire Skullsplitter Fetishes from their Witchdoctors and Mystics.

column1: Mai'Zoth^46^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Brother Nimetz^Brother Nimetz^^Troll Witchery^^Bring the Mind's Eye to Brother Nimetz at the Rebel Camp.^Kurzen may be dead
column2: but...that which drove him to evil still lives! Through my studies I have discovered this: An Ogre Mage - Mai'Zoth - dwells in an Ogre Mound within the eastern mountains of Stranglethorn. He is rumored to employ mind-controlling magic
column3: and I am positive that he corrupted Kurzen. If Mai'Zoth is allowed to live
column4: then his evil may influence others
column5: and may even cause another Kurzen to surface. Kill him
column6: and bring me his Mind's Eye
column7: the artifact he uses to corrupt others.

column1: Kurzen's Mystery^38^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Brother Nimetz^Brother Nimetz^Kurzen's Mystery^Colonel Kurzen^^Find the 4 tablets and bring their legends back to Brother Nimetz.^Colonel Kurzen was once a great
column2: noble man - I must find what caused his fall into depravity! He may be under the sway of troll magic. To confirm this
column3: I must study some of their legends. There are 4 tablets hidden within the troll ruins of Stranglethorn. I must see what is written on these tablets! Transcribe their markings and bring the transcriptions back to me. The first tablet is in the Bal'lal Ruins
column4: the second is in the Vile Reef
column5: and the third and fourth are in the Ruins of Zul'Kunda.

column1: Big Game Hunter^43^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Hemet Nesingwary Jr.^Hemet Nesingwary Jr.^^Tiger Mastery
column2: Panther Mastery
column3: Raptor Mastery^^Hemet Nesingwary Jr. wants you to bring him the head of King Bangalash
column4: the great white tiger.^<name>
column5: you are a hunter worthy of our company. From the battlefields of Lordaeron to the deepest jungle
column6: I have rarely witnessed such prowess with weaponry as you have demonstrated. You have killed the ferocious Sin'Dall
column7: the elusive Bag'thera and the treacherous Tethis. But the true prize is the head of King Bangalash. That white tiger is the reason I am here. I've had my sights on him for quite some time now. Kill King Bangalash and your hunting prowess is proven to be second to none.

column1: Skullsplitter Tusks^42^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Kebok^Kebok^^Bloodscalp Ears^^Acquire 18 Skullsplitter Tusks and return them to Kebok.^It's expensive and hard to kill enough tigers to support the export of tiger fangs to the islands in the South Seas. Luckily
column2: we've developed a technique that allows us to take mundane horn-like objects and turn them into undetectable forgeries. The closest match we've found
column3: amazingly
column4: are the tusks of the Skullsplitter trolls. Hey
column5: before you say anything
column6: what the buyer doesn't know doesn't hurt them
column7: am I right? Bring me a large number of them so we can get to work on the monthly shipment!

column1: Krazek's Cookery^37^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Corporal Kaleb^Krazek^Krazek's Cookery^^^Bring Krazek's Crock Pot to Krazek the goblin.^I do most of the cooking at the camp. And it used to be a lot of work
column2: until I bought a mechanical cooking pot from a goblin merchant in Booty Bay. The pot is a wonder! It saved me countless hours...until it broke! Can you take the pot back to the goblin for me so he can fix it? His name is Krazek.

column1: Alas
column2: Andorhal^60^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Commander Ashlam Valorfist^Commander Ashlam Valorfist^^All Along the Watchtowers^^Bring Araj's Phylactery Shard to Commander Ashlam Valorfist at Chillwind Camp
column3: Western Plaguelands.^Alas
column4: the time to attack Andorhal and drive out the lich that controls it is upon us! Inside the ruins of the city is where the lich - Araj the Summoner - holds dominion. He is guarded by numerous Scourge surrounding the remains of city's center
column5: and his personal retinue of guardians attached to him directly is formidable. You will need numerous allies to even stand a chance of facing him successfully. Destroy Araj
column6: <name>
column7: and bring me a shard from his phylactery as proof!

column1: A Meal Served Cold^40^Alliance^Stormwind City^Angus Stern^Angus Stern^^^^Kill a Cold Eye Basilisk
column2: get a Chilled Basilisk Haunch
column3: and return it to Angus Stern in the Blue Recluse.^One of my most famous dishes is Chilled Basilisk in Lime Vinaigrette. But the problem is... the meat is impossible to keep fresh
column4: and I must serve the dish tonight for a noble's birthday! So if you can bring me a Chilled Basilisk Haunch from a freshly-killed Cold Eye Basilisk
column5: quickly
column6: then I will owe you a king's feast! Cold Eye Basilisks are known to roam along the beach dunes of northwestern Stranglethorn
column7: so you have much traveling to do. And be swift!

column1: Hostile Takeover^36^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Kebok^Kebok^^^^Retrieve 8 Tumbled Crystals and return them to Kebok in Booty Bay.^He's done it this time! Bad enough that Gelriz's muscling out the moguls who were appointed by the trade princes
column2: now he tries to cut in on the most notorious pirate! Revilgaz won't have it
column3: and he's told me to take care of the problem in my own way. My way? Theft. The Venture Co. geologists near Lake Nazferiti are deeply interested in those strange blue crystals they have been finding in the mines. Bring me samples of the stone from their geologists
column4: I don't care what you have to do to get them.

column1: Red Silk Bandanas^17^Alliance^The Deadmines^Scout Riell^Scout Riell^^The Defias Brotherhood^^Scout Riell at the Sentinel Hill Tower wants you to bring her 10 Red Silk Bandanas.^It's no secret that the trademark of the Defias Gang is their Red Bandanas. But we've learned that the material from which these bandanas are made signifies the member's rank. That being said
column2: I want you to eliminate as many high ranking Defias members as you can. The highest ranking members will undoubtedly be found in VanCleef's secret hideout. When you're done bring me 10 Red Silk Bandanas as proof of their deaths and I will reward you. Good luck
column3: <name>.

column1: Jungle Secrets^33^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Private Thorsen^Lieutenant Doren^Jungle Secrets^^^Speak with Lieutenant Doren at the Rebel Camp.^Thank you for saving me
column2: <name>. I know how this looks
column3: but...allow me to explain. I was charged by Lieutenant Doren to re-enlist with Kurzen's men
column4: so that I might spy on them and bring sorely needed intelligence to the rebels. You saw here what I had thought would be my chance to infiltrate Kurzen's Compound. I was wrong
column5: and again
column6: thanks for saving me. This was a top secret mission
column7: so you must tell no one. But if you speak with Doren he will explain.

column1: Between a Rock and a Thistlefur^24^Horde^Ashenvale^Karang Amakkar^Karang Amakkar^^^King of the Foulweald^Take down 8 Thistlefur Avengers and 8 Thistlefur Shaman; most are located east of Zoram Strand in Thistlefur Village. Once completed
column2: return to Karang Amakkar at Zoram'gar Outpost
column3: Ashenvale.^The Thistlefur furbolgs are threatening our expansion! Thistlefur Village to our east blocks the way between us here and the Splintertree Post. It's a path that would circumvent the village of Astranaar; without it
column4: we give the Alliance an extra expansion path. <name>
column5: we must not allow... an expansion path gap! Proceed to Thistlefur Village and thin out the furbolgs. You will be given compensation for this task
column6: but more importantly you will be doing your duty for the Horde!

column1: In Defense of the King's Lands^17^Alliance^Loch Modan^Captain Rugelfuss^Captain Rugelfuss^^In Defense of the King's Lands^^Kill the Trogg leader
column2: Grawmug
column3: and his two guards
column4: Gnasher and Brawler then report back to Captain Rugelfuss in the southern guard tower.^<name>
column5: our scouts have identified the leader of this recent Trogg incursion. It appears that these beasts in Loch Modan are following the lead of a chieftain named Grawmug. Grawmug is heavily guarded
column6: however. Two of his most elite guards
column7: Gnasher and Brawler
column8: never leave his side. If you feel yourself worthy
column9: <name>
column10: I want you to lead the assassination mission on Grawmug and his two thugs. With the Trogg leadership dead
column11: we just might stand a chance at pushing these beasts back into the ground.

column1: The Stolen Journal^5^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Grelin Whitebeard^Grelin Whitebeard^The Troll Cave^^^Grelin Whitebeard wants you to kill Grik'nir the Cold
column2: and retrieve his journal.^My journal! They took it away to the cave. The one that had it... It was a big brute with some odd markings on his skin and face. I didn't get a much better look than that. You've had some luck with the trolls
column3: maybe you could go get it back for me?

column1: Missing In Action^25^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Corporal Keeshan^Marshal Marris^^^^Protect Corporal Keeshan on the journey back to Redridge.^At last
column2: friends of the Alliance! Help... please... The last thing I remember these foul Orcs overpowered our regiment. Most the men were killed. I took a strong blow to the head and everything went black. Now I am held captive in this cave. Help me
column3: I am hurt badly. I'll need help getting back to town... please... you're my last hope...

column1: Call of Water^20^Horde^Shaman^Brine^Islen Waterseer^Call of Water^^Call of Water
column2: Water Sapta^Bring the Vial of Purest Water to Islen Waterseer at the Tidus Stair in the Barrens.^Islen will have one more task for you before rewarding you with your next totem. The vial of water I've given you is necessary for whatever that task is. Go now and find her. We shall meet again some day.

column1: Worgen in the Woods^29^Alliance^Duskwood^Calor^Calor^Worgen in the Woods^^^Kill 12 Nightbane Dark Runner worgen for Calor in Darkshire.^You might have noticed some larger worgen wandering around with the Shadow Weavers in the woods? From what we can tell
column2: these Dark Runners make up the bulk of the worgen numbers. On my rangings
column3: I've also noticed that they have overrun the Rotting Orchard southwest of town. These worgen are a bit tougher than the last you faced. Be on your guard.

column1: Worgen in the Woods^31^Alliance^Duskwood^Calor^Calor^Worgen in the Woods^^^Kill 8 Nightbane Vile Fang and 8 Nightbane Tainted One worgen for Calor in Darkshire.^Your previous accomplishments have convinced me that you are ready to take on the toughest worgen infesting the woods. Of the worgen that have made their new home here
column2: the Vile Fangs and the Tainted Ones have proven the most dangerous. They've settled down near some of the caves and in the mine to the south. From far away you can even see the light from their bonfires...

column1: Worgen in the Woods^31^All^Duskwood^Calor^Jonathan Carevin^Worgen in the Woods^^^Bring Calor's note to Jonathan Carevin.^Here you go
column2: <name>. Bring this message to Master Carevin. <He quickly removes a piece of faded parchment and offers it to you.> A few more like you
column3: and we will outnumber the Night Watch! Perhaps then we could complete the work that we few carry on today.

column1: In Defense of the King's Lands^12^Alliance^Loch Modan^Mountaineer Cobbleflint^Mountaineer Cobbleflint^^^In Defense of the King's Lands^Mountaineer Cobbleflint of the southern guard tower wants you to kill 10 Stonesplinter Troggs and 10 Stonesplinter Scouts.^We need to protect the Loch
column2: <name>! With so many of the King's soldiers fighting valiantly on remote battlefields
column3: we've become overwhelmed on the home front. Troggs are tunneling up from every crevice! The Trogg infestation poses the largest threat to Ironforge. These disgusting mutants must be destroyed. We need you
column4: brave adventurer
column5: to venture forth and lay waste to the Trogg threat. Slay 10 Stonesplinter Troggs and 10 Stonesplinter Scouts and report back.

column1: The Weathered Grave^30^Alliance^Duskwood^A Weathered Grave^Sirra Von'Indi^The Weathered Grave^^^Speak with Sirra Von'Indi in Darkshire.^The weathered grave marker reads simply: MORGAN LADIMORE <Upon further examination
column2: you notice that dirt over the grave has been recently disturbed
column3: and that a good amount of the dirt seems to have been displaced...>

column1: Wolves at Our Heels^21^Alliance^Duskwood^Lars^Lars^^^^Kill 12 Starving Dire Wolves and 8 Rabid Dire Wolves
column2: then return to Lars at Sven's Camp on the western border of Duskwood.^Sven and I have dangerous days ahead of us
column3: what with the Necromancer to the east and all. And out here alone as we are
column4: we have to hunt for our own food. It seems every time I'm heading back to camp with some meat on me
column5: starving or rabid dire wolves come out of the forest wanting a bite. It goes without saying
column6: living out here is dangerous work! But if you can rid us of some of those wolves
column7: we'd have an easier time of it. They mostly prowl north and east of here
column8: near the river.

column1: Morgan Ladimore^30^Alliance^Duskwood^Sirra Von'Indi^Commander Althea Ebonlocke^The Weathered Grave^^^Speak with Commander Althea Ebonlocke in Darkshire.^<He searches through the shelves and comes up with a leatherbound book.> If you would like to know more
column2: you might ask Althea
column3: she's been the one to handle the... trouble... with him of late.

column1: Mor'Ladim^30^All^Duskwood^Commander Althea Ebonlocke^Commander Althea Ebonlocke^The Weathered Grave^^^Kill Mor'Ladim
column2: then return his skull to Commander Althea Ebonlocke in Darkshire.^From what my scouts tell me
column3: Mor'Ladim wanders throughout Duskwood
column4: following a strange and meandering path through the cemetery. We buried him out past the house on the hill
column5: you know where that is? There isn't anything I can do to help you
column6: but I wish you good luck.

column1: The Daughter Who Lived^30^Alliance^Duskwood^Commander Althea Ebonlocke^Watcher Ladimore^The Weathered Grave^^^Speak with Watcher Sarah Ladimore in Darkshire.^I should have told you this earlier... How do I put this... Morgan may have believed that his family was all dead
column2: but
column3: in fact
column4: his daughter Sarah Ladimore is now a Watcher. She's always been troubled by the... circumstances... surrounding her father's death. Perhaps you could go to bring the news to her.

column1: Sven's Camp^25^Alliance^Duskwood^Mound of loose dirt^Sven Yorgen^Sven's Revenge^^^Bring the Book from Sven's Farm to Sven.^Digging through the mound
column2: you find a small
column3: dirt-stained book. The book has no title
column4: but...it has information Sven would like to know.

column1: A Daughter's Love^30^Alliance^Duskwood^Watcher Ladimore^A Weathered Grave^The Weathered Grave^^^Take Sarah Ladimore's ring to Morgan Ladimore's grave.^Here
column2: take this and lay it on his grave. Maybe... somehow
column3: he'll know that I'm okay
column4: and that none of us hold him responsible for what happened. <There are tears in her eyes now
column5: as she slides a ring from her right hand
column6: and presses it into your hands.> And... thank you
column7: <name>.

column1: Errand for Apothecary Zinge^45^Horde^Undercity^Apothecary Zinge^Alessandro Luca^Errand for Apothecary Zinge^^^Take the purchase order to Alessandro Luca in the Undercity.^The Royal Apothecary Society needs your assistance. Listen closely
column2: and both of us may profit from my plan. Apothecary Keever in the next room may be... touched... but his research does potentially bear fruit if it were pursued by a clever researcher. Fortunately
column3: I am such a researcher. I want you to take this purchase order to Alessandro Luca
column4: the proprietor of Blue Moon Odds and Ends; he'll give you a testing kit. When you have it
column5: bring it back to me and I'll outline your task in detail.

column1: Coldridge Valley Mail Delivery^3^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Sten Stoutarm^Talin Keeneye^^Dwarven Outfitters^Coldridge Valley Mail Delivery^Deliver the stack of letters to Talin Keeneye in Coldridge Valley.^Hm
column2: I don't suppose you'd be willing to do a favor for me
column3: <lad /lass>? A stack of letters came through the pass today
column4: but I don't have the time to send them along. They're all addressed to Talin Keeneye. You can find him to the west down the road. He's set up camp next to the frozen lake. What do you say?

column1: Coldridge Valley Mail Delivery^4^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Talin Keeneye^Grelin Whitebeard^^Coldridge Valley Mail Delivery^^Deliver the letter to Grelin Whitebeard in Coldridge Valley.^If I remember correctly
column2: Grelin's camp is down the road to the southeast. No doubt he'll be eager to get his mail.

column1: The Ashenvale Hunt^20^Horde^Orgrimmar^Warcaller Gorlach^Senani Thunderheart^^^^Speak with Senani Thunderheart at Splintertree Post
column2: Ashenvale.^Attention
column3: young adventurers! The wilds of Ashenvale await you! The Horde has established a strong presence in the lands north of the Barrens. Our two outposts - Splintertree Post and the Zoram Strand Outpost - strive to bring glory to the Horde! Those who would prove themselves should seek out guidance there. Of note: Senani Thunderheart in Splintertree Post
column4: directly north of the Barrens
column5: seeks adventurers willing to take part in a great hunt of Ashenvale!

column1: Fueling the Demolishers^80^All^Wintergrasp^Siege Master Stouthandle^Commander Zanneth^^^^Siege Master Stouthandle at Wintergrasp Fortress wants you to retrieve 10 Eternal Embers from Horde players at the Cauldron of Flames.^<name>! About time you showed up. While the battle may be over
column2: we still need to prepare for the next battle. Travel to the Cauldron of Flames in south eastern Wintergrasp and retrieve several eternal embers. The embers are mixed in with coal to fuel the Demolisher and Siege Engines. Oh
column3: and if you happen to see some of the Horde in the Cauldron
column4: don't hesitate to slay them and take their embers. We can't let them have the advantage in the next battle.

column1: In Defense of the King's Lands^15^Alliance^Loch Modan^Mountaineer Gravelgaw^Mountaineer Gravelgaw^^In Defense of the King's Lands^In Defense of the King's Lands^Mountaineer Gravelgaw in the southern guard tower wants you to kill 10 Stonesplinter Skullthumpers and 10 Stonesplinter Seers and report back to him.^Mountaineer Cobbleflint had nothing but good things to say about you
column2: <race>. For that reason I am going to entrust upon you a mission of utmost importance. We need to keep pressure on the invading Trogg forces until our Dwarven brethren return from the Alliance front. Set forth into the southern hills and kill 10 Stonesplinter Skullthumpers and 10 Stonesplinter Seers. Your attacks will buy us some time. Report back when your mission is complete.

column1: Errand for Apothecary Zinge^45^Horde^Undercity^Alessandro Luca^Apothecary Zinge^Errand for Apothecary Zinge^^^Bring the Field Sampling Kit to Apothecary Zinge in the Undercity.^The kit is ready
column2: <name>. No doubt that Apothecary Zinge will want this as soon as possible. Take it to her without delay
column3: and let her know that I will add the cost of the kit to the Society's tab. Also
column4: please extend to her my warmest salutations. Well
column5: don't just stand there. Such is the life of a simple courier
column6: yes?

column1: Westbrook Garrison Needs Help!^10^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Marshal Dughan^Deputy Rainer^Westbrook Garrison Needs Help!^^^Go to the Westbrook Garrison and speak with Deputy Rainer.^The Garrison on our western border sends word of increasing gnoll and thief activity. They're requesting we send more Stormwind soldiers... but we just don't have any to spare! If you can help
column2: we could use it. Go and speak with Deputy Rainer at the Westbrook Garrison and see what he needs done. The Garrison is down the road to the west. After you cross the bridge over the small brook it will be to the right.

column1: Return to Jitters^20^Alliance^Duskwood^Chef Grual^Jitters^Jitters' Growling Gut^^^Return to Jitters with the Dusky Crab Cakes.^And here we are - "Crab" Cakes ala Grual!

Into the Field^46^Horde^Tanaris^Apothecary Zinge^Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle^Errand for Apothecary Zinge^^^Speak to Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle in Gadgetzan about getting a power source for the testing kit.^You will be headed to the Tanaris desert
column2: testing the tissue consistency of the basilisks
column3: scorpids
column4: and hyena native there. Obtain tissue samples and use them with the testing kit in tow; expect a chunk of the samples to fail. I need eight acceptable samples of each creature type. In addition
column5: the goblins of Gadgetzan have a power source that must be used with this kind of modified kit. Speak to Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle and acquire one for the kit. Return to me only when you are successful.

column1: Encroaching Gnolls^16^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Guard Parker^Deputy Feldon^Encroaching Gnolls^^^Report to Deputy Feldon at the bridge south of Lakeshire in Redridge Mountains.^Hail
column2: <class>. I am charged to patrol this stretch of road. Although the road is safe for now
column3: I've seen gnoll encampments to the north and east of here. Lakeshire must know of the gathering gnoll force! Report to Deputy Feldon in Lakeshire and tell him of the gnolls. Do this
column4: and I'm sure Feldon will offer you a scout's wage. Feldon's usually inspecting the area south of the bridge to Lakeshire.

column1: Eight-Legged Menaces^21^Alliance^Duskwood^Watcher Dodds^Watcher Dodds^^^^Kill 15 Pygmy Venom Web Spiders
column2: and then report back to Watcher Dodds in Duskwood.^Hail
column3: <class>. Perhaps you've seen those spiders that have taken over the western border? The eight-legged menaces are too much for us to handle
column4: and the Commander hasn't enough manpower to spare so far from Darkshire. I hate to ask this of you
column5: but you seem like you might be able to handle them. I can't promise you anything of great value
column6: but I can reward you if you can help root out the filthy bugs. Oh
column7: and a word of advice
column8: you'll want to avoid their venom if you can.

column1: Assessing the Threat^17^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Deputy Feldon^Deputy Feldon^Encroaching Gnolls^^^Kill 10 Redridge Mongrels and 6 Redridge Poachers
column2: then report back to Deputy Feldon in Lakeshire.^We don't have men to spare
column3: but something must be done about those gnolls you reported to me. Scout southern Redridge for gnolls. Harry them
column4: kill those you can and report back to me with a count of their numbers and an assessment of the threat they present. You may find those gnolls camped all along the southern road of Redridge. Do this for the Stormwind Army
column5: <name>
column6: and you will be rewarded.

column1: Looking Further^22^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Old Lion Statue^An Empty Jar^A Watchful Eye^^Morganth^Climb the intact watch tower beside Stonewatch Keep in Redridge Mountains.^I have been watching the Tower of Ilgalar
column2: and can detect that Morganth is in conflict with the Orcs in Stonewatch Keep. I do not know the reason behind their contention
column3: but you may aid me in unraveling this mystery. Take another Glyph of Azora
column4: then go to the top of the intact watch tower beside Stonewatch Keep. Find a suitable object on which to place the Glyph. A chest or a jar -- some place where the glyph will not be noticed -- will suit my purpose.

column1: Morganth^26^Alliance^Redridge Mountains^Theocritus^Theocritus^^Looking Further^^Defeat Morganth.^After much observation
column2: I have discovered Morganth's plans. He searches for the Scythe of Elune...and he may have found it! If he has
column3: then the Redridge Mountains
column4: and the kingdom of Stormwind
column5: will soon feel his dark might. I am not prepared to pit myself against Morganth
column6: but I fear he must be dealt with now. So you must enter the Tower of Ilgalar and face Morganth. Defeat him
column7: and bring me his Pendant of Shadow. Do this
column8: and the kingdom will owe you much.

column1: A Dark Threat Looms^18^Alliance^Loch Modan^Chief Engineer Hinderweir VII^Suspicious Barrel^A Dark Threat Looms^^^Investigate the area near the eastern ramp of the Dam and bring Chief Engineer Hinderweir a clue that might reveal what the Dark Iron Dwarves are up to.^Thank the stars someone is concerned about the well-being of the Dam. First the destruction of the Thandol Span and then the pillaging of Dun Modr! I have no doubt that the Dam will be the target of the next Dark Iron threat. Most of the security detail here was reassigned to the Alliance Front
column2: including my top inspector. That's why I need you
column3: <name>. I spotted some Dark Iron Sappers milling about the eastern ramp of the Dam. Investigate the area and bring back a clue.

column1: Translate Abercrombie's Note^30^Alliance^Duskwood^Lord Ello Ebonlocke^Sirra Von'Indi^Supplies from Darkshire^^Wait for Sirra to Finish^Bring the Letter to Ello to Sirra Von'Indi.^Take the note you gave me to Sirra Von'Indi. He's very learned in languages and ancient arts - if anyone here can translate this message
column2: it's he.

column1: Translation to Ello^30^Alliance^Duskwood^Sirra Von'Indi^Lord Ello Ebonlocke^Wait for Sirra to Finish^^Bride of the Embalmer^Bring the Translated Letter to Lord Ello Ebonlocke^Oh my! If what is written on this note is true
column2: then Abercrombie's done something...unspeakable. You better bring the translated note back to Ello. And do so quickly
column3: for I fear a doom already lumbers toward our town...

column1: Bride of the Embalmer^30^Alliance^Duskwood^Lord Ello Ebonlocke^Lord Ello Ebonlocke^^Translation to Ello^^Find Eliza's grave. Retrieve the Embalmer's Heart from her
column2: then return to Ello Ebonlocke.^The Embalmer is a name told in one of our children's stories. He was a kindly alchemist
column3: driven mad by the death of his wife
column4: Eliza. To restore her
column5: he used dark magic to place his own heart within the bosom of his dead spouse. This revived Eliza...but it cursed her with a hunger for human flesh
column6: forcing the Embalmer to keep her buried. His heart is his power. Find his wife's grave
column7: retrieve his heart
column8: and bring it to me while it still beats. Do this and his power will be broken.

column1: Mercenaries^19^Alliance^Loch Modan^Magistrate Bluntnose^Magistrate Bluntnose^^^^Magistrate Bluntnose of Thelsamar has hired you to kill 4 Mo'grosh Ogres
column2: 4 Mo'grosh Brutes and 4 Mo'grosh Enforcers.^Two months just to hear from Ironforge that we'll be spared a handful of soldiers for our own defense
column3: and another two months until they arrive! Bad enough that our town goes unprotected
column4: but the excavation and the dam--the dam!--are open to attacks as well. I've no choice then
column5: it seems. I'll need hired arms. How about you? You seem a likely sort
column6: <class>. A group of ogres has set up camp on the northeast of the lake. Perhaps you will be the one to remove the threat to our town?

column1: WANTED: Chok'sul^22^Alliance^Loch Modan^WANTED^Magistrate Bluntnose^^^^Kill Chok'sul and bring his head to Magistrate Bluntnose of Thelsamar.^By order of the Magistrate of Thelsamar: Chok'sul
column2: the ogre presumed to be the leader and coordinator of attacks against the town of Thelsamar
column3: Stonewrought Dam
column4: and the excavation site
column5: is wanted dead through any means necessary. Monetary compensation will be provided when proof is brought to the Magistrate of Chok'sul's death. Chok'sul was last seen at the ogre encampment in the northeastern part of Loch Modan.

column1: A Hunter's Boast^16^Alliance^Loch Modan^Daryl the Youngling^Daryl the Youngling^A Hunter's Boast^^^Kill 6 Mountain Buzzards and return to Daryl the Youngling in the Farstrider Lodge within 15 minutes.^Think you can match wits with Daryl the Bold
column2: huh? I should think not! Of course
column3: you're more than welcome to try. Here's a challenge that should prove to be above your abilities
column4: so don't feel too bad if you can't face up to it. A flock of buzzards has nested here in Loch Modan. Why don't you try to take down some of the beasts? Tell you what
column5: if you meet my challenge in fifteen minutes
column6: I'll give you my bow or gun. <He looks you over dismissively.> It seems you haven't much to lose
column7: anyways.

column1: A Hunter's Challenge^17^Alliance^Loch Modan^Daryl the Youngling^Daryl the Youngling^A Hunter's Boast^^Vyrin's Revenge^Kill 5 Elder Mountain Boars and return to Daryl the Youngling in the Farstrider Lodge within 12 minutes.^<name>ath
column2: is it? I can tell you're bursting with pride over completing the first test
column3: hm? As I told you before
column4: it's no large feat. You should try your hand at boar hunting. Trust me
column5: this is no Coldridge Valley boar hunt
column6: so you'd best have a care with them. I'll give you just twelve minutes this time. Don't feel bad if you fail. I'd give you the shirt off my back if you succeeded! Have I ever related to you the story of how I received my famous scar? No? It was two years ago...

column1: Down the Scarlet Path^39^Alliance^Desolace^Brother Anton^Brother Anton^Brother Anton^^^Destroy 30 Undead Ravagers
column2: then return to Brother Anton at Nijel's Point.^I will be frank. We are at war with the Scourge. It is an evil that corrupts our people and infects our land. It must be stopped before it overwhelms us and drags our world into shadow. We of the Scarlet Crusade have sworn to fight the Scourge with body and soul. If you are with us
column3: then gather your courage and prove your allegiance--destroy the undead ravagers of Desolace
column4: in the Valley of Bones to the south. Do this
column5: and the Crusade will embrace you.

column1: The Shadowy Figure^25^Alliance^Duskwood^Sven Yorgen^Madame Eva^Sven's Revenge^^^Take the book you found at Sven's farm and show it to townsfolk in Darkshire.^I must know who was that skulker in the shadows I saw the night my family was killed! Please
column2: <name>
column3: you have shown your resourcefulness. Please find that shadowy figure. I must learn what secrets he holds! I do not have clues that you do not already know
column4: but here - take the book you found at my farm. Perhaps some of the townsfolk can link this book with its owner.

column1: In Defense of the King's Lands^15^Alliance^Loch Modan^Mountaineer Wallbang^Mountaineer Wallbang^^In Defense of the King's Lands^In Defense of the King's Lands^Mountaineer Wallbang in the southern guard tower wants you to kill 10 Stonesplinter Shaman and 10 Stonesplinter Bonesnappers.^The Mountaineers tell me you are quite brave and capable
column2: <name>. We need a <race> like you around here. The Trogg problem isn't getting any better. The reserves have been called to the front and we're all alone out here. But now that we have a seasoned <class> here
column3: let's see what you can do. Go out and kill 10 Stonesplinter Shaman and 10 Stonesplinter Bonesnappers. Let's see if you live up to your reputation
column4: Trogg-Slayer.

column1: Until Death Do Us Part^15^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Clarice Foster^Yuriv's Tombstone^^^^Place Clarice's Pendant on Yuriv's Tomb in Silverpine.^Filthy scum! Leaves me for his damn crusade. Because "the Light is the most important thing we have against the threats the undead pose." Well
column2: what about his children?! What about ME?! Night after night I sat patiently waiting for him... always second to his blasted duty! Well
column3: witness what "justice" brings you
column4: <name>! He's dead and I'm bearing the very thing he was trying to stop! Take this piece of junk and put it on his tomb at the Sepulcher. I want nothing to do with it anymore... or him!

column1: The Shadowy Search Continues^25^Alliance^Duskwood^Madame Eva^Clerk Daltry^Sven's Revenge^^^See if other townsfolk have clues about the shadowy figure.^Here is your book back
column2: <name>
column3: and I bid you fortune with your search. If you ask others in town
column4: perhaps they can offer you more clues. And here is one more for you - although the author of this book is a stranger to Darkshire
column5: the book itself was purchased here.

column1: Inquire at the Inn^25^Alliance^Duskwood^Clerk Daltry^Tavernkeep Smitts^Sven's Revenge^^^Search the inn for clues about the shadowy figure.^Here is your book
column2: and good luck with your inquiries. You might want to expand your search to the inn. If the person whom you seek spent time in town
column3: then chances are someone saw him there.

column1: The Trogg Threat^12^Alliance^Loch Modan^Captain Rugelfuss^Captain Rugelfuss^^^^Bring 8 Trogg Stone Teeth to Captain Rugelfuss in the southern guard tower.^<class>
column2: you may or may not be aware of the Trogg threat looming over Dwarven lands. With the Ironforge Reserve called up to the Alliance Front
column3: we are left with a fraction of the defense forces needed to keep these lands safe. My regiment is assigned to watch over the Gate here and we cannot leave our post for fear of invasion. But we need some pressure put on those damned Troggs lurking in the hills. If you're up to the task
column4: wage an assault on the Troggs. Bring me back 8 Trogg Stone Teeth as proof.

column1: Return to Sven^25^Alliance^Duskwood^Jitters^Sven Yorgen^Sven's Revenge^^^Return to Sven with Jitters' completed journal.^The book you found was only half finished. I had to leave it at Sven's farm when I fled there... Here. Take my completed journal to Sven. It describes more fully what happened at his farm. Although this journal has been my only company these past weeks
column2: if giving it up keeps me from having to face Sven and his wrath
column3: then I do it willingly!

column1: Seeking Wisdom^29^Alliance^Duskwood^Sven Yorgen^Bishop Farthing^Sven's Revenge^^^Give Jitters' Completed Journal to Bishop Farthing in Stormwind.^Go to the city of Stormwind and speak with Bishop Farthing in the Cathedral of Light. Give him Jitters' journal and tell him you mean to face Morbent Fel. Although Stormwind has forsaken Darkshire
column2: Farthing is a kind soul and very wise. He may help you on your quest to save us. Your mission is perilous
column3: but hurry
column4: <name>. With each passing hour
column5: the shadows of Duskwood grow ever darker.

column1: The Doomed Fleet^29^Alliance^Duskwood^Bishop Farthing^Glorin Steelbrow^Sven's Revenge^^^Go to Menethil Harbor in the Wetlands
column2: and speak with Glorin Steelbrow.^Years ago
column3: the Third Fleet of Kul Tiras sunk along the coasts of The Wetlands
column4: an expanse of marsh north of the dwarven kingdom of Ironforge. Aboard one ship was a load of Lightforge Iron. This metal is precious to us
column5: for items crafted from it strike with holy truth. If you are to face Morbent Fel
column6: then you will need such a weapon. Go to Menethil Harbor and speak with my dwarven colleague Glorin Steelbrow. If that lost metal can be found
column7: he'll know where to look.

column1: Vyrin's Revenge^20^Alliance^Loch Modan^Vyrin Swiftwind^Daryl the Youngling^Vyrin's Revenge^A Hunter's Challenge^^Kill Ol' Sooty then show your handiwork to Daryl the Youngling at the Farstrider Lodge.^I don't suppose you'd be interested in a little payback for His Boldness? Daryl does have some skill
column2: it pains me to say. A year ago
column3: a large bear had been the target of the Farstrider Lodge
column4: but none of the hunters had any luck with him. So
column5: Daryl thought he'd try his hand against him. All he had to show for his effort was that ugly scar over his eye. Kill the bear
column6: and I'm sure even Daryl would be speechless for once. The bear
column7: Ol' Sooty
column8: can be found around his lair in the hills over Thelsamar.

column1: Trial of the Sea Lion^16^Night Elf^Druid^Tajarri^Dendrite Starblaze^A Lesson to Learn^^^Find the Half Pendant of Aquatic Agility and the Half Pendant of Aquatic Endurance. Speak with the residents of Moonglade to learn clues as to where these items may be located.^For the second trial
column2: you'll need the two halves that make the Pendant of the Sea Lion. One half draws power from the agility of the sea lion aspect
column3: gliding through water; the other draws power from the incredible endurance of the sea lion aspect. Druids draw on both these traits equally to embody the aspect of their aquatic form. Speak with the locals of Moonglade to learn where the parts may lie
column4: and bring both here to join them together. Once formed
column5: take the pendant to Dendrite Starblaze.

column1: Resupplying the Excavation^15^Alliance^Loch Modan^Jern Hornhelm^Huldar^Excavation Progress Report^^^Speak with Huldar.^It's not too late though
column2: you're welcome to go look for Huldar. He can't have made it very far
column3: strong as they are
column4: Miran and Saean can only move so fast laden down with those barrels. They're taking the normal route to the site
column5: leaving south out of town and following the curve of the Loch. Shouldn't have a problem finding them unless they've already gotten there.

column1: A Dark Threat Looms^18^Alliance^Loch Modan^Ashlan Stonesmirk^Chief Engineer Hinderweir VII^A Dark Threat Looms^^^Ashlan Stonesmirk wants you to return to Chief Engineer Hinderweir in Loch Modan and inform him of the new discovery.^This ain't no ordinary blast powder. Look at the tiny silver crystals. And the distinct smell! Why it's clear as daylight that this is Seaforium Powder. Seaforium is harmless enough. But once it's wet it could blow Ironforge out of the mountain. The chemical reaction can be defused by mixing four components: lurker venom
column2: crushed Mo'Grosh crystal
column3: a crocolisk tear and this disarming colloid. Now tell Hinderweir before it's too late!

column1: Blisters on The Land^26^Alliance^Wetlands^Rethiel the Greenwarden^Rethiel the Greenwarden^The Greenwarden^^^Kill 8 Fen Creepers
column2: then return to Rethiel the Greenwarden in the Wetlands.^I do not know why
column3: but a festering grows within the Wetlands. Fen Creepers have risen. They are diseased
column4: fevered blisters on the land
column5: and for the fever to break they must be dispatched and allowed to settle back into the marshes. The Fen Creepers shamble amidst the waterways of the Wetlands.

column1: Tramping Paws^21^Alliance^Wetlands^Rethiel the Greenwarden^Rethiel the Greenwarden^The Greenwarden^^^Kill 15 Mosshide Gnolls and 10 Mosshide Mongrels
column2: then return to Rethiel the Greenwarden in the Wetlands.^The Mosshide Gnolls have lived in the Wetlands peacefully for many years
column3: but now grow in numbers. Their feet stamp flat the fen's bushes and flowers
column4: and their foul axes cut too much wood to fuel their fires. They are no longer in balance with the land. For the Wetlands to survive
column5: the Gnolls must be reduced. Kill 15 Mosshide Gnolls and 10 Mosshide Mongrels. Hunt them to the south
column6: near the Dwarven gate of Algaz. After you do this
column7: return to me.

column1: Fire Taboo^23^Alliance^Wetlands^Rethiel the Greenwarden^Rethiel the Greenwarden^The Greenwarden^^^Bring Rethiel the Greenwarden 9 Crude Flints.^The Mosshides are cutting the trees of the Wetlands
column2: using the trees' flesh to warm themselves with fire. I will suffer this pain no longer! Rid the Mosshides of their crude flints
column3: the tools they use to make fire. The flints are borne by all Mosshides except the smaller Mosshide gnolls and Mosshide mongrels.

column1: A Dark Threat Looms^18^Alliance^Loch Modan^Chief Engineer Hinderweir VII^Chief Engineer Hinderweir VII^A Dark Threat Looms^^^Chief Engineer Hinderweir wants you to gather Lurker Venom
column2: a Mo'grosh Crystal
column3: and a Crocolisk Tear.^Begin collecting the disarming materials immediately
column4: <name>. Lurker Venom can be found on the indigenous spiders in Loch Modan. Crocolisk tears are found here in the Loch as well. But a Mo'Grosh crystal will be very difficult to procure. The ogres to the northeast mine them but the crystals are a very rare commodity. We need to be prepared to defuse a Dark Iron attack! Return to me once you've collected the needed items and I will prepare the mixture.

column1: Claws from the Deep^22^Alliance^Wetlands^Karl Boran^Karl Boran^Claws from the Deep^^^Kill 12 Bluegill Murlocs.^Murlocs are crawling out from the deep waters and building their villages on the coastline. They are harassing our fishers and merchants and must be stopped. One of these murlocs
column2: Gobbler
column3: skulks with other bluegill murlocs and harries merchants along the road
column4: always then retreating to the safety of the nearby murloc hovels. Our merchants are in jeopardy
column5: and we will pay to secure them. Gobbler prowls the river inlet north of here. Find him
column6: slay his kin
column7: and bring me his head.

column1: A Dark Threat Looms^18^Alliance^Loch Modan^Chief Engineer Hinderweir VII^Explosive Charge^A Dark Threat Looms^^^Chief Engineer Hinderweir wants you to swim down to the base of the dam
column2: locate the powder keg and stir in the Disarming Mixture to prevent an explosion.^Earlier today I spotted some Dark Iron Insurgents swimming toward the Dam with a large keg. No Mountaineers were on hand to stop them! I'm afraid they've planted the Seaforium at the base of the Dam and it could blow at any minute! Let me combine all these ingredients into the Disarming Mixture. There we go. Now I need you to take this mixture and stir it into the keg before it's too late! Hurry!

column1: Reclaiming Goods^25^Alliance^Wetlands^Karl Boran^Damaged Crate^Claws from the Deep^^^Search the crates and barrels at the coastal Murloc camps.^Not long ago a merchant vessel
column2: the Blind Princess
column3: was raided by Murlocs. Although the ship escaped intact
column4: much of its cargo was dragged overboard by the creatures
column5: including a very valuable statuette of Terenas Menethil. We want that statuette recovered. Search the coastal Murloc hovels for crates
column6: barrels and other evidence of lost cargo. Find the Menethil Statuette and return it to me.

column1: Senir's Observations^5^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Grelin Whitebeard^Mountaineer Thalos^The Troll Cave^^Senir's Observations^Speak with Mountaineer Thalos.^I was planning on sending my apprentice to my brother Senir with my report
column2: but I would feel much better were it placed in more... reliable hands. That is
column3: of course
column4: if you wouldn't mind? Hmm... you'll have to take the tunnel to get to Kharanos. Speak with Mountaineer Thalos before going through the tunnel. It's completely infested with troggs now. Follow the road back to Anvilmar
column5: then keep heading east to the tunnel
column6: Thalos is stationed nearby.

column1: A Dark Threat Looms^20^Alliance^Loch Modan^Explosive Charge^Chief Engineer Hinderweir VII^A Dark Threat Looms^^^The Disarming Mixture seemed to take effect. Return to Chief Engineer Hinderweir to report the good news.^The keg fizzles slightly.
The Search Continues^25^Alliance^Wetlands^Damaged Crate^Sealed Barrel^Claws from the Deep^^^Search for the Menethil Statuette.^You thoroughly search this cluster of Murloc hovels
column2: and find no trace of the Menethil Statuette. Perhaps one of the two nearby hovels to the north and northeast will have more clues.

column1: Search More Hovels^25^Alliance^Wetlands^Sealed Barrel^Half-buried Barrel^Claws from the Deep^^^Continue searching the Murloc hovels for the Menethil Statuette.^This grouping of Murloc hovels
column2: after a thorough inspection
column3: reveals nothing. ...but you're certain that the next clue you find will be fruitful. One of the hovels to the north must have the Menethil Statuette!

column1: Return the Statuette^25^Alliance^Wetlands^Half-buried Barrel^Karl Boran^Claws from the Deep^^^Bring Karl Boran at Menethil Harbor in Wetlands the Menethil Statuette.^After pulling the barrel free from the muck and opening it
column2: a silvery figurine is found packed in fine straw. It depicts a young
column3: long-haired Paladin with hammer upraised. This must be the Menethil Statuette! You must now return it to Karl Boran in Menethil Harbor.

column1: Frostmane Hold^9^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Senir Whitebeard^Senir Whitebeard^Frostmane Hold^Senir's Observations^^Explore Frostmane Hold
column2: and kill 5 Frostmane Headhunters for Senir Whitebeard in Kharanos.^I'm behind on my report
column3: and could use your help
column4: <name>. I just managed to find where the trolls are holed up
column5: but I saw so many trolls
column6: I was afraid to go in. Here's what I need... Go down to the cave
column7: poke around inside
column8: kill a few of the trolls
column9: then come back here. Take the road north out of Kharanos
column10: when you get to the bridge
column11: follow the frozen river west until you reach Iceflow Lake. You'll find Brewnall Village on the west bank. The Hold is southwest of the village.

column1: The Third Fleet^27^Alliance^Wetlands^First Mate Fitzsimmons^First Mate Fitzsimmons^The Third Fleet^^^Buy First Mate Fitzsimmons a Flagon of Mead.^I was once First Mate on the Wave Mistress
column2: ship-of-the-line in the Kul Tiras Third Fleet. The Doomed Fleet. Doomed
column3: for on its last voyage the fleet was attacked by Red Dragons. Dragons controlled by Orcs! We didn't stand a chance against that dragonfire...and our fleet was burned and sunk off this here coast. I'm the sole survivor of those poor vessels... ...Oh
column4: my head hammers and pounds! I'll need a fresh drink if I'm to get a handle on this hangover and continue my tale.

column1: The Cursed Crew^29^Alliance^Wetlands^First Mate Fitzsimmons^First Mate Fitzsimmons^The Third Fleet^^^Kill 13 Cursed Sailors
column2: 5 Cursed Marines and First Mate Snellig. Bring Snellig's Snuffbox to First Mate Fitzsimmons in Menethil Harbor.^<Bolstered
column3: Fitzsimmons continues his tale...> I am the sole survivor of the ill-fated Third Fleet of Kul Tiras
column4: wrecked off the coast to the north. But although I'm the only member of the fleet still breathing
column5: I'm not the only one still walking about! For on one of our ships was hidden a great
column6: and terrible treasure
column7: and the eerie power of it keeps the souls of my brothers trapped within the ships' rotting hulls. But if you can free some of my brothers
column8: then perhaps you can break their curse.

column1: Lifting the Curse^30^Alliance^Wetlands^First Mate Fitzsimmons^Intrepid's Locked Strongbox^The Third Fleet^^^Get the Intrepid Strongbox Key from Captain Halyndor.^To break the curse and free all of my brethren
column2: the...thing...stowed on my ship must be retrieved and cleansed! I don't know what it was
column3: but I do know that it was stored securely in the ship's strongbox
column4: which Captain Halyndor lorded over. My old captain is still in my dreams. I know he walks my doomed ship
column5: the Intrepid. Get the key from him
column6: and use it to open the Intrepid's strongbox. Then
column7: after you have the cursed thing
column8: bring it to the priest Glorin Steelbrow in town.

column1: The Reports^10^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Senir Whitebeard^Senator Barin Redstone^Frostmane Hold^^^Deliver Senir's report to Senator Barin Redstone in Ironforge.^Excellent! Take my report to Senator Barin Redstone. He's a sour type
column2: so don't let his less-than-sunny disposition get to you. He's in Ironforge
column3: in the chamber where King Magni holds court. Don't know the way to Ironforge? Take the road out of Kharanos north
column4: cross the bridge
column5: then follow the road east--there are large banners flanking the road--up the mountainside. By the way
column6: if you might avoid mentioning how you assisted me? Can't let them think I'm not working hard out here
column7: you know?

column1: The Eye of Paleth^30^Alliance^Wetlands^Intrepid's Locked Strongbox^Glorin Steelbrow^The Third Fleet^^^Bring the Cursed Eye of Paleth to Glorin Steelbrow at Menethil Harbor in Wetlands.^Opening the chest reveals a blackened orb
column2: pulsing with an eerie light. It is the treasure of which Fitzsimmons spoke: a Cursed Eye of Paleth. Take the Cursed Eye of Paleth to the dwarven priest Glorin Steelbrow
column3: in Menethil Harbor. Ask him how to remove the Eye's curse.

column1: Cleansing the Eye^30^Alliance^Wetlands^Glorin Steelbrow^Archbishop Benedictus^The Third Fleet^^^Bring Archbishop Benedictus the Cursed Eye of Paleth. Benedictus is in the Cathedral of Light
column2: in the city of Stormwind.^I can't lift the curse from the Eye of Paleth. The Eyes were crafted by Human Priests
column3: so you'll have to go to Stormwind to find someone who can help you. Speak with Archbishop Benedictus. He is head of the Cathedral of Light in Stormwind. He can help. I hope
column4: for your sake.

column1: Ormer's Revenge^24^Alliance^Wetlands^Ormer Ironbraid^Ormer Ironbraid^Ormer's Revenge^^^Ormer Ironbraid at the Whelgar Excavation Site wants you to kill 10 Mottled Screechers and 10 Mottled Raptors.^The situation is severe
column2: that much is for sure. When we uncovered these bones it attracted the Raptors. These filthy beasts killed my brethren and trapped me
column3: Merrin and the poor Prospector up here. Help clear the Wetlands of these Raptors
column4: <name>. Mottled Raptors and Mottled Screechers are just West of the bluff there. Kill 10 of each
column5: if you can. That will be a good start to the vengeance I have planned for them.

column1: Ormer's Revenge^27^Alliance^Wetlands^Ormer Ironbraid^Ormer Ironbraid^Ormer's Revenge^^^Ormer Ironbraid wants you to kill 10 Mottled Scytheclaw raptors and 10 Mottled Razormaw raptors then return to him at the Whelgar Excavation Site.^Now it's time to really make those dreaded Raptors regret their blood-thirst. Just down below there are scores of Mottled Scytheclaws and Mottled Razormaws. Make those rotten creatures pay by slaying 10 of each!

Ormer's Revenge^29^Alliance^Wetlands^Ormer Ironbraid^Ormer Ironbraid^Ormer's Revenge^^^Ormer Ironbraid at the Whelgar Excavation Site wants you to kill Sarltooth and return to him with one of his talons once the task is fulfilled.^While you were down there I happened to notice that one of those beasts stood out from the rest. He was bigger and more menacing. I bet he's the one who led the others here to cause the disruption to the dig site. I ask of you now one final task
column2: <name>. See to it that Sarltooth is brought to justice. And considering the gravity of his crimes
column3: justice in this case means death! Bring me one of his talons as proof of his death.

column1: Gathering Idols^18^Alliance^Loch Modan^Magmar Fellhew^Magmar Fellhew^Ironband's Excavation^^^Bring Magmar Fellhew 8 Carved Stone Idols.^Recently
column2: just before the Troggs surfaced within the site
column3: we had uncovered a large number of strange
column4: carved idols. But we didn't have the chance to study them
column5: for soon after their discovery the Troggs chased us away from the ruins! And those idols have a strange effect on the Troggs. It makes them go berserk! Bring me 8 idols - I want to study them
column6: and I want them out of Trogg hands! You can find the idols on the Troggs infesting the site.

column1: Excavation Progress Report^15^Alliance^Loch Modan^Prospector Ironband^Jern Hornhelm^Excavation Progress Report^^^Bring Ironband's Progress Report to Jern Hornhelm in Thelsamar.^I need a progress report sent to Thelsamar - a progress report
column2: and a restatement of my request for more blastpowder! Here's the report. Take it to Jern Hornhelm. He's our local contact in Thelsamar. It's not a difficult task
column3: but it must be done.

column1: Uncovering the Past^28^Alliance^Wetlands^Prospector Whelgar^Prospector Whelgar^^^^Prospector Whelgar wants you to scour the excavation site in search of the 4 missing tablet fragments: Ados
column2: Modr
column3: Golm and Neru.^Just before the invasion I uncovered a large tablet called the Goaz Stone. The translated text breaks off in 4 places. The text speaks of a "divine plan" and a "doomed prophecy." I fear we are running out of time. I am too old to go down and brave those beasts. But you are strong. Scour the excavation site and uncover the 4 missing tablet fragments: Ados
column4: Modr
column5: Golm and Neru. Search for them in ancient artifacts or where the soil is loose. Bring them to me so I can begin unlocking the mystery!

column1: Report to Ironforge^15^Alliance^Loch Modan^Jern Hornhelm^Prospector Stormpike^Excavation Progress Report^^^Take Ironband's Progress Report to Prospector Stormpike.^We'll need approval to get Ironband more blastpowder. You'll have to take his report to the Explorers' League headquarters in Ironforge. Here's the report. Give it to Prospector Stormpike
column2: and don't forget to duck after you deliver it. Stormpike is hotheaded
column3: and he won't be happy to hear of Ironband's slow progress at the site. You'll find Stormpike in the Assembly of Explorers.

column1: Powder to Ironband^15^Alliance^Loch Modan^Prospector Stormpike^Jern Hornhelm^Excavation Progress Report^^^Speak with Jern Hornhelm at Thelsamar in Loch Modan.^If Ironband still needs blastpowder
column2: then by Magni he'll have it! I sent the approval on ahead with a messenger to Jern Hornhelm in Thelsamar. He'll prepare the powder and other supplies to take to Ironband. And one more thing: I want you to personally see that the shipment of powder reaches its destination. The last one didn't
column3: so keep your mind sharp and your eyes open.

column1: The Dark Iron War^30^Alliance^Wetlands^Motley Garmason^Motley Garmason^^^The Fury Runs Deep^Motley Garmason at Dun Modr wants you to kill 10 Dark Iron Dwarves
column2: 5 Dark Iron Tunnelers
column3: 5 Dark Iron Saboteurs and 5 Dark Iron Demolitionists.^War rages both home and abroad. While mighty Dwarven soldiers give their lives in far off territories in the name of the Alliance
column4: our own lands fall prey to the evil deeds of the Dark Iron Dwarves. They laid waste to the Thandol Span. Dun Modr fell soon after. We need you to gather force and push the front back. If you can kill 10 Dark Iron Dwarves
column5: 5 Tunnelers
column6: 5 Saboteurs and 5 Demolitionists
column7: the reserve might arrive in time to finish the drive. Now make haste!

column1: A Grim Task^31^Alliance^Wetlands^Longbraid the Grim^Longbraid the Grim^^^^Kill Balgaras the Foul and bring his ear to Longbraid the Grim outside of Dun Modr.^Many of my soldiers died in the battle of Dun Modr. My own brother perished when the West Bridge over the Thandol Span was destroyed. Aye
column2: the Dark Iron dwarves are a devilish breed. From what Roggo was able to gather
