column3: the leader of the thugs in the Wetlands is a warlock named Balgaras the Foul. He is quite a coward
column4: sending his soldiers to do his bidding but hides in his camp on Direforge Hill
column5: to the southeast. If you can find the spineless scum
column6: slay him and bring me his ear. I will reward you
column7: <class>.

column1: In Search of The Excavation Team^24^Alliance^Wetlands^Tarrel Rockweaver^Merrin Rockweaver^In Search of The Excavation Team^^^Tarrel Rockweaver wants you to travel to the Excavation Site and contact Merrin Rockweaver.^Oh my
column2: you must be the scout Longbraid said he would send! You cannot imagine how worried I have been. My wife
column3: Merrin
column4: has been sending me letters each week for the past month. She is part of the Whelgar Excavation team. But it has been nearly two weeks since her last correspondence. Surely something is wrong! Longbraid said that he would send a scout to check up on things if we did not hear from the team soon. I assume that scout is you
column5: <name>. Find Merrin at the excavation site to the east!

column1: In Search of The Excavation Team^24^Alliance^Wetlands^Merrin Rockweaver^Tarrel Rockweaver^In Search of The Excavation Team^^^Return to Tarrel Rockweaver at Menethil Harbor in Wetlands with Merrin's note.^It was horrible! We were uncovering some rare artifacts and we began to discover these large bones. Before we knew what was happening
column2: these Mottled Raptors overwhelmed the dig site. Many lives were lost. Ormer here -- so brave -- saved the Prospector and me. He defended us as we ran for shelter. Now we are trapped. And our hard work lies in ruin. Here
column3: take this note back to my sweet Tarrel. It will explain the situation to him.

column1: Filthy Paws^15^Alliance^Loch Modan^Mountaineer Stormpike^Mountaineer Stormpike^^^^Go to the Silver Stream Mine and collect 4 loads of Miners' Gear.^The Silver Stream Mine to the east ran dry long ago. It was converted by the Miners' League into a storage depot
column2: but now Kobolds have moved in
column3: putting their filthy paws on good
column4: Dwarven tools! We'll root out those vermin soon enough
column5: but the League wants someone to get their gear out of the mine before we warriors tromp in there and break things. It'll be a tough delve - you might want cohorts at your side. The gear is stored in Miners' League Crates throughout the mine. Good luck.

column1: Protecting the Shipment^15^Alliance^Loch Modan^Miran^Prospector Ironband^^After the Ambush^^Ensure Miran and the shipment arrive at the excavation site
column2: then inform Prospector Ironband.^Ready to go
column3: <name>? First
column4: we need to get this powder to Ironband. It'll be a lot for me to carry
column5: and these parts can get dangerous -- and who knows what else the Dark Irons might have in store for me. I'll feel a lot better with you coming along.

column1: Bitter Rivals^6^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Marleth Barleybrew^Unguarded Thunder Ale Barrel^Bitter Rivals^^^In the basement of the Thunderbrew Distillery in Kharanos
column2: replace a barrel of Thunder Ale with a Barrel of Barleybrew Scalder.^I have to admit
column3: those Thunderbrews make some good drinks. But they need to learn that theirs isn't the only decent brew! Maybe you can help me teach them that lesson... Here
column4: take this barrel of Barleybrew Scalder. Sneak into the basement of the Thunderbrew Distillery in Kharanos and switch it with one of their barrels of Thunder Ale. Then we'll see how their patrons like my brew over theirs! And if the barrels are guarded
column5: then you might have to distract the guard ...

column1: Return to Marleth^7^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Unguarded Thunder Ale Barrel^Marleth Barleybrew^Bitter Rivals^^^Bring the barrel of Thunder Ale to Marleth Barleybrew at the Brewnall Village.^Having inserted a barrel of Marleth's Scalder in the Kharanos Distillery's cellar
column2: you grab a barrel of Thunder Ale as proof of the deed...

column1: Tundra MacGrann's Stolen Stash^12^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Tundra MacGrann^Tundra MacGrann^^^^Retrieve Tundra MacGrann's dried meats from the stolen meat locker in Old Icebeard's cave.^I had a month's worth of dried meats salted and locked away for the cold season. Kept it locked so the bears wouldn't get it! But while I was off hunting deer
column2: that beast
column3: Old Icebeard
column4: made off with the meat locker. He won't be able to smash through that Thorium though. But I'll starve if I can't get my meats back. You seem a bit more stealthy than me. Perhaps you can retrieve my stash? I'll never make it in and out of that cave fast enough with this bum leg of mine.

column1: The Grizzled Den^7^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Pilot Stonegear^Pilot Stonegear^^^^Gather 8 Wendigo Manes and bring them to Pilot Stonegear.^Driving a Siege Engine isn't for everyone. It takes an iron grip and nerves of steel...lucky I have both! How about you? How's your mettle? Want to prove it to me? Well...I'm looking to make my engine
column2: Trollplow
column3: a little more cozy. How about you get me a heap of Wendigo Manes from the Grizzled Den
column4: west of Kharanos. Those manes would make a great rug for Trollplow's inside deck!

column1: Protecting the Herd^12^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Rudra Amberstill^Rudra Amberstill^^^^Rudra Amberstill wants you to slay Vagash and bring his fang to her at the Ram ranch.^We heard the cries in the middle of the night. Then this morning
column2: sure enough
column3: the herd was missing two rams. That dastardly beast known as Vagash has been preying on our livelihood. With most of King Magni's army off in distant lands fighting with the Alliance
column4: there is no one to keep Vagash at bay. Perhaps you are brave enough to seek out the beast and slay him. Bring me one of his fangs and I will reward you. Vagash lurks just above the ranch here
column5: but be warned
column6: he is deadly.

column1: The Perfect Stout^9^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Rejold Barleybrew^Rejold Barleybrew^^^Rejold's New Brew^Bring 6 Shimmerweeds to Rejold Barleybrew in the Brewnall Village.^I'm on a quest
column2: a quest to make the perfect stout. I know I can do it -- brewing's in my blood. I just need to find the right recipe... The Frostmane trolls grow a plant
column3: shimmerweed
column4: high up in the hills to the east. They use it in their strange
column5: tribal rituals. We dwarves haven't found much use for it
column6: but it has a unique taste...and I want to experiment with it in my brews! Get me some shimmerweed from Frostmane seers
column7: or swipe it from the trolls' shimmerweed baskets.

column1: Stocking Jetsteam^6^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Pilot Bellowfiz^Pilot Bellowfiz^Stocking Jetsteam^^^Gather 4 Chunks of Boar Meat and 2 Thick Bear Furs
column2: and deliver them to Pilot Bellowfiz at Steelgrill's Depot.^I'm preparing to start a mission for the Siege Brigade. It's a long one
column3: and I need to stock Jetsteam with a month's worth of supplies. So while Steelgrill is working on my tank
column4: can you do some hunting for me? I'll need some fur for bedding
column5: and boar meat for food. You can get meat from boars and fur from the bears... you can find them both in the snow fields south of the Grizzled Den.

column1: Evershine^7^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Pilot Bellowfiz^Rejold Barleybrew^Stocking Jetsteam^^^Get a cask of Evershine from Rejold Barleybrew in Brewnall Village.^Rejold Barleybrew experiments with his brews. Some of them taste good
column2: some bad
column3: and some...well
column4: some will lay all but the stoutest dwarf flat. He lives at Brewnall Village
column5: west of Kharanos
column6: and one of his drinks
column7: Evershine
column8: is what I want. It'll help keep me warm while I'm on the cold road. And...the blessed stuff burns so hot I can throw it in Jetsteam's furnace for a burst of power! That little tactic has gotten me out of more than one tight spot.

column1: A Favor for Evershine^8^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Rejold Barleybrew^Rejold Barleybrew^Stocking Jetsteam^^^Kill 6 Ice Claw Bears
column2: 8 Elder Crag Boars
column3: and 8 Snow Leopards
column4: and then return to Rejold Barleybrew in Brewnall Village.^I have a cask of Evershine handy
column5: but...can you do me a favor? Brewnall village could use a hand against the wild animals that wander the nearby snows. Sometimes they wander close. We're not afraid of these bears and cats and boars - no self respecting dwarf would be - but if you can take care of those animals for us
column6: then we'd have more time for our crafting and brewing.

column1: Return to Bellowfiz^8^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Rejold Barleybrew^Pilot Bellowfiz^Stocking Jetsteam^^^Give the cask of Evershine to Pilot Bellowfiz at Steelgrill's Depot.^Here's your cask of Evershine
column2: <name>. And again
column3: thank you for the hunting earlier.

column1: Lightforge Iron^29^All^Duskwood^Glorin Steelbrow^Waterlogged Chest^Sven's Revenge^^^Search the wreckage of The Flying Osprey in the Wetlands.^The shipwrecks off the shore here are the doomed Third Fleet of Kul'Tiras
column2: burned and sunk by Red Dragons during the last Great War. The Fleet hailed from Lordaeron
column3: but one ship
column4: an Elvish Destroyer: Flying Osprey
column5: was with it. It was shipping a load of Lightforge Iron and joined the Third Fleet for protection. Ironic that it sunk to the same dragons... Enough history. The Flying Osprey is wrecked to the south of Menethil Harbor. If you find the Lightforge Iron there
column6: bring it to me.

column1: Blessed Arm^29^Alliance^Duskwood^Glorin Steelbrow^Grimand Elmore^Sven's Revenge^^^Take the Crate of Lightforge Ingots to Grimand Elmore in Stormwind.^There is a dwarven weaponsmith in the Dwarven District of Stormwind who can craft with lightforge iron. His name is Grimand Elmore. I've packed the iron you found into a crate. Take it to Grimand and tell him your tale. I'm sure he'll oblige someone on a quest such as yours
column2: and craft for you a weapon - a weapon to give even Morbent Fel worry!

column1: Proving Your Worth^28^Alliance^Duskwood^Sven Yorgen^Sven Yorgen^Sven's Revenge^^^Kill 15 Skeletal Raiders
column2: 3 Skeletal Healers and 3 Skeletal Warders
column3: and then return to Sven.^Morbent Fel is a necromancer
column4: and an ally to the dark riders. I would pit you against the power of Morbent Fel
column5: but I will not send you against that vile fiend without first knowing your strength. You have already proven your bravery to me
column6: but if you truly wish to face the necromancer
column7: then you must now prove your skill against his minions.

column1: The Lost Ingots^29^Alliance^Duskwood^Waterlogged Chest^Glorin Steelbrow^Sven's Revenge^^Lightforge Ingots^Gather 5 Lightforge Ingots
column2: then return to Glorin Steelbrow in the Wetlands.^Having grabbed the single lightforge ingot from the waterlogged chest
column3: it is clear that murlocs have stolen the rest. Hunt the murloc raiders near the Flying Osprey wreckage for the lost lightforge iron.

column1: Armed and Ready^29^All^Duskwood^Grimand Elmore^Sven Yorgen^Sven's Revenge^^^Bring Morbent's Bane to Sven in Duskwood.^Here is the weapon against the fiend of which you spoke. You're all ready
column2: <name>. Best of luck to you
column3: and I look forward to your tale of glory!

column1: The Hidden Key^37^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Bookie Herod's Records^Bookie Herod's Strongbox^Jungle Secrets^^^Use the Small Brass Key to open Bookie Herod's Strongbox.^Although no mention of Private Thorsen is found in these records
column2: hidden within the binding of one of Herod's ledger books is a small
column3: brass key. And after further study of his notes
column4: a few references to a "secure strongbox" are contained among various papers. The box is somewhere within the Stockpile - the cavern complex at the back of Kurzen's Compound. If this secure strongbox is found
column5: and the small brass key can open it
column6: then perhaps the mystery behind Thorsen's detection will be revealed.

column1: The Spy Revealed!^37^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Bookie Herod's Strongbox^Lieutenant Doren^Jungle Secrets^^^Take the Muddy Note to Lieutenant Doren at the Rebel Camp.^Among the valuables of the strongbox is a muddy
column2: scribbled note. Although barely legible
column3: it looks to be an itinerary for Private Thorsen. It details his patrol routes
column4: who he speaks with and how he spends his time with the rebels. It's signed with only one letter: -M. But whoever wrote this note must have stayed very close to Thorsen. Whoever wrote this note is the traitor within the rebel camp.

column1: Patrol Schedules^37^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Lieutenant Doren^Corporal Sethman^Jungle Secrets^^^Speak with Corporal Sethman.^The note you gave me is signed with an "-M"...I don't know what that could mean. But...the note also says this person shared patrol routes with Thorsen last week. So whoever shared patrol with Thorsen last week must be the traitor! Go to Corporal Sethman. He handles the patrol schedules and can tell you who was with Thorsen.

Report to Doren^37^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Corporal Sethman^Lieutenant Doren^Jungle Secrets^^^Speak with Lieutenant Doren.^Did Lieutenant Doren want you to report back to him with that patrol information?
Wine Shop Advert^2^Alliance^Stormwind City^Renato Gallina^Suzetta Gallina^^^^Go to the Gallina Winery
column2: and bring Suzetta Gallina the Wine Ticket for a free bottle of wine.^If you talk to anyone about wine
column3: then you know we Gallinas sell the best wine in Stormwind. And we're not far
column4: still in the Trade District along the city's lovely canals. Here
column5: take this pamphlet. Bring it to my sister Suzetta at our shop for a complimentary bottle of our famous pinot noir. You won't regret it!

column1: Harlan Needs a Resupply^2^Alliance^Stormwind City^Harlan Bagley^Rema Schneider^^^^Go to the Canal Tailor Shop and bring Rema Schneider the Cloth Request from Harlan Bagley.^We've been doing a lot of business lately. It seems like everyone is buying armor and sturdy clothes. Almost like they expect a cold
column2: harsh season ahead... But those are future worries. My worry today is that I'm running out of knitted clothing to sell. I need another load from our supplier. If you can take this request to Rema Schneider at the Canal Tailor and Fit Shop
column3: I'd be most grateful.

column1: Package for Thurman^2^Alliance^Stormwind City^Rema Schneider^Thurman Schneider^^^^Go to the Larson Clothiers in the Stormwind Mage Quarter
column2: and give Thurman Schneider his Sewing Kit.^My son Thurman is an apprentice at the Larson Clothiers
column3: in the Mage's Quarter. He was in a hurry today and forgot his shears and needles. I know a great <class> like you must have important tasks at hand
column4: but without his tools Thurman can't do his apprentice work! Please
column5: <name>. Can you take my son's sewing kit to him? Larson Clothiers is one of two clothing shops in the Mage's Quarter - it's the one deeper in
column6: near the Mage's Tower.

column1: A Noble Brew^30^Alliance^Stormwind City^Zardeth of the Black Claw^Zardeth of the Black Claw^A Noble Brew^^^Zardeth the Black Claw wants you to bring him a Tear of Tilloa from Darkshire and a Musquash Root from the Wetlands.^Lord Wishock is causing quite a stir amongst the House of Nobles. He was made aware of our little "establishment" down here and is lobbying for a full investigation. I have a plan to keep Wishock "preoccupied
column2: but I'll need your help. There is a flower growing in the Garden of Stalvan on the outskirts of Darkshire. This small white flower is known as the Tear of Tilloa. I will also need a Musquash Root, found only at the very base of the falls far beneath the Stonewrought Dam in the Wetlands.A Noble Brew^30^Alliance^Stormwind City^Zardeth of the Black Claw^Lord Baurles K. Wishock^A Noble Brew^^You Have Served Us Well^Take the Black Claw Stout to Lord Wishock in the Hall of Petitioners.^Lord Wishock, like all men, has his weaknesses. His happens to be a fondness for liquor. The hypocrisy is astounding. The trite fool spends his days trying to shut down our little tavern" while his nights are spent upstairs
column3: running up a bill he never pays. Well
column4: let's see how Wishock likes this special brew I have prepared for him: Black Claw stout. It's got quite a kick
column5: <name>. Take it to him and see how he likes it. Most likely the old fool is milling about the Hall of Petitioners.

column1: An Old History Book^25^Alliance^Duskwood^An Old History Book^Milton Sheaf^An Old History Book^^^Return the book: The History of Stormwind
column2: to the Stormwind Library.^Although the cover of this book is marred by scratches and caked with mud
column3: the words "The History of Stormwind" can still be read along its spine. Upon opening the book
column4: the seal of the Stormwind Library is clearly stamped on the book's first page. It looks like someone checked out this book
column5: and never returned it...

column1: The Green Hills of Stranglethorn^40^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Barnil Stonepot^Barnil Stonepot^^Welcome to the Jungle^^Collect the missing pages from The Green Hills of Stranglethorn manuscript. Once all four chapters are complete
column2: return them to Barnil.^Master Nesingwary will be so upset if he finds out! He trusted me to proofread the manuscript of his novel
column3: The Green Hills of Stranglethorn. Everything was going well
column4: but a large gust of wind blew through the camp and scattered the pages everywhere! I was able to gather most of the pages but many are still strewn about the jungle. Collect the pages to complete each of the four chapters. I will help you organize them. Return the chapters to me once you have all four.

column1: Chapter I^40^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Barnil Stonepot^Barnil Stonepot^^^^Bring pages 1
column4: and 8 of Nesingwary's The Green Hills of Stranglethorn to Barnil Stonepot in order to complete Chapter I.^Chapter I was quite riveting! Master Nesingwary sets the backdrop for the story and makes mention of his hunting companions
column5: including me! But that's besides the point. Let me see which pages are still missing. It seems pages 1
column7: 6 and 8 are still out there somewhere in the jungle!

column1: Chapter II^40^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Barnil Stonepot^Barnil Stonepot^^^^Bring pages 10
column3: 14 and 16 of Nesingwary's The Green Hills of Stranglethorn to Barnil Stonepot in order to complete Chapter II.^Chapter II was chock full of exciting tales of panther and tiger hunting. I could just kick myself for letting the pages blow away!  It seems I was able to recover all of the pages with the exception of pages 10
column6: and 16.

column1: Chapter III^40^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Barnil Stonepot^Barnil Stonepot^^^^Bring pages 18
column3: 21and 24 of Nesingwary's The Green Hills of Stranglethorn to Barnil Stonepot in order to complete Chapter III.^Chapter III was my favorite. It tells of Sir Erlgadin and Lady Rouack's first kill with a dwarven rifle. And the end of Chapter III
column4: why
column5: such a cliffhanger! Looks to me as though we still need pages 18
column7: 21 and 24 to finish the chapter. Those pages are out there somewhere. . .

column1: Chapter IV^40^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Barnil Stonepot^Barnil Stonepot^^^^Bring pages 25
column3: and 27 of Nesingwary's The Green Hills of Stranglethorn to Barnil Stonepot in order to complete Chapter IV.^Ah Chapter IV; the big finale! And what an ending it was! We are only missing three pages for this chapter. We need pages 25
column4: 26 and 27 to put Chapter IV back together.

column1: Speaking of Fortitude^24^Alliance^Stormwind City^Brother Kristoff^Milton Sheaf^Speaking of Fortitude^^^Go to the Royal Library in Stormwind Keep and speak with Milton Sheaf. He can find for you the book on metallurgy that Brother Kristoff needs for his speech.^I'm giving a speech on the Fortitude of the Spirit
column2: and I'd like to recite passages from a particular book on metallurgy - "The Stresses of Iron." A copy of this book should be in the Royal Library
column3: within Stormwind Keep. Can you retrieve it for me? If so
column4: then may the blessings of the Light be with you! The Royal Library is very large
column5: but the head librarian
column6: Milton Sheaf
column7: knows each shelf like it was his own son. Speak to him
column8: he'll retrieve the book for you.

column1: Brother Paxton^24^Alliance^Stormwind City^Milton Sheaf^Brother Paxton^Speaking of Fortitude^^^Speak with Brother Paxton in the Northshire Abbey.^The Stresses of Iron? Yes
column2: I know the book. Quite a good one
column3: written by the Dwarven miner Margulf Blaggon a few decades ago. He spent most his time deep in the mountains of Khaz Modan
column4: digging ore. Smart fellow! But where was I? Oh yes
column5: the Stresses of Iron! I'm afraid the book was moved to the Northshire Abbey. The caretaker of the Abbey's library
column6: Brother Paxton
column7: wanted to make a copy of the book for his own shelves. But that was months ago. I wonder why it's taking him so long...

column1: Ink Supplies^24^Alliance^Stormwind City^Brother Paxton^Foreman Oslow^Speaking of Fortitude^^^Speak with Foreman Oslow in Lakeshire and ask him for Rethban Iron Ore.^I've been meaning to finish my copy of The Stresses of Iron
column2: but... Well you see
column3: I make my own ink for books I copy. It's my own recipe; it doesn't run or smear
column4: and it dries very quickly. Unfortunately
column5: it dries too quickly! My last batch dried up before I could finish the copying job
column6: and I haven't had the chance to make more ink! To make more I need Rethban Iron Ore from the Redridge Mountains. Foreman Oslow in Lakeshire is my usual supplier.

column1: Return to Kristoff^24^Alliance^Stormwind City^Brother Paxton^Brother Kristoff^Speaking of Fortitude^^^Return to Brother Kristoff in the Cathedral Square. Give him the book The Stresses of Iron.^Now that I've finished copying the book
column2: here's the original Stresses of Iron. Thank you for your patience
column3: and if you see Milton please tell him I'm sorry for the long delay.

column1: Rethban Ore^24^Alliance^Stormwind City^Foreman Oslow^Brother Paxton^Speaking of Fortitude^^^Gather 5 loads of Rethban Ore and bring it to Brother Paxton in the Northshire Library.^Rethban Ore is named after the man who first found it
column2: Bart Rethban. When smelted it's not as strong as iron
column3: but its ore has a dark
column4: flat color that some scribes use in their dyes. It can be found in the Rethban Caverns
column5: north of here. We usually have some in stock
column6: but we're too busy preparing for Orc attacks to gather any. And besides...Redridge Gnolls are now living in the Rethban Caverns and their Drudgers are gathering the ore themselves. So if you need some
column7: you'll have to get it yourself.

column1: Stranglethorn Fever^45^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Fin Fizracket^Fin Fizracket^^^^Seek out Witch Doctor Unbagwa and have him summon Mokk the Savage. Bring the Heart of Mokk to Fin Fizracket.^Sick...so...very s-s-sick.... ...have contracted Stranglethorn Fever...deadly v-v-virus... ...only cure...is...is...to eat the heart of M-m-m-m-mokk the Savage...elusive white beast... ...Witch doctor Unbagwa...only one who can s-s-summon.... ...seek Unbagwa in hidden cave on southern cape... ...hurry...dying...dying....

Look to an Old Friend^31^Alliance^Stormwind City^Master Mathias Shaw^Elling Trias^The Unsent Letter^^^Speak to Elling Trias in Stormwind.^That Marzon would be contacting a member of the Defias and have ties to Lescovar... Having killed VanCleef and Thredd
column2: it would be hard to see Lescovar brought to proper justice
column3: as your evidence is nothing without their testimonies. That is not even considering the fact that Lescovar is a noble and well connected. It effectively makes him above the law. You'll need other help. I loathe to do so
column4: but there is someone I know that will aid us. You'll find Trias in the Trade District of the city.

column1: Find OOX-17/TN!^48^All^Tanaris^OOX-17/TN Distress Beacon^Homing Robot OOX-17/TN^Find OOX-17/TN!^^^Bring the distress beacon to Oglethorpe's homing robot.^You have uncovered some sort of strange
column2: egg-shaped device made from metal. Fiddling with one of its knobs springs the egg to life
column3: as it opens up into some sort of gnomish robotic contraption! A voice from inside the robotic egg crackles to life. "The name's Oglethorpe
column4: and my homing robot has gone missing! I will reward you for its recovery! Please take this beacon to the robot. Excellent
column5: I now have computed the coordinates for you! It crashed near the Gaping Chasm in Tanaris!"

column1: Stormpike's Delivery^15^Alliance^Stormwind City^Grimand Elmore^Mountaineer Stormpike^Elmore's Task^^^Deliver the Package for Stormpike to Mountaineer Stormpike in Loch Modan.^The Stormpikes are a respected dwarven clan
column2: and are well known for their fine and discerning tastes. So it's no wonder that Gringer Stormpike
column3: a Mountaineer of Ironforge
column4: commissioned me to craft him a weapon. The weapon is finished
column5: but... Mountaineer Stormpike is far away
column6: in distant Loch Modan. If you plan on traveling to the north
column7: can you deliver this package to him? My last message from Mountaineer Stormpike said he's stationed at the northern guard tower in Loch Modan.

column1: Deaths in the Family^11^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Coleman Farthing^Coleman Farthing^^^Speak with Sevren^Bring Gregor's Remains
column2: Nissa's Remains and Thurman's Remains to Coleman Farthing in Brill.^The Agamand family was the most prosperous family in Tirisfal Glades. I used to work their mills...before the Plague. When the Scourge first came
column3: the Agamands fortified their home and convinced those in their employ to remain and help them defend. We were fools
column4: but at least we were loyal fools. The Agamands
column5: in their pride
column6: doomed us to undeath. And now they are minions of the Scourge! Serve the Forsaken by defeating the Agamands who fell to the Plague. Serve me by bringing me their remains.

column1: Speak with Sevren^10^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Coleman Farthing^Magistrate Sevren^Speak with Sevren^Deaths in the Family^^Speak with Magistrate Sevren in Brill.^You have given me the remains of the Agamands
column2: and satisfied my desire for revenge. But the Agamand Mills hold a threat to all the Forsaken
column3: not just to me. I have spoken to Magistrate Sevren of your exploits against the Agamands
column4: and he wishes to speak with you.

column1: Rear Guard Patrol^11^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Deathguard Linnea^Deathguard Linnea^^^^Kill 8 Bleeding Horrors and 8 Wandering Spirits
column2: then report back to Linnea at her camp.^The defenders on The Bulwark protecting Tirisfal from the Plaguelands are on constant alert. But sometimes Scourge will slip past them. Our success at the Bulwark depends on a one-front battle - we cannot allow an attack from the rear
column3: nor can we allow our defenders' supply line to be cut. Assist the Bulwark. Patrol east and slay any Scourge you find. Spend particular effort at the Balnir Farmstead to the east. It has become a haven for interloping Scourge.

column1: The Lich's Identity^8^Horde^Undercity^Bethor Iceshard^Bethor Iceshard^The Prodigal Lich^^^Bring the Lich's Spellbook to Bethor Iceshard in the Undercity.^There is a lich who dwells on the island in Brightwater Lake to the north. Although he is a free-willed Forsaken
column2: he believes all other Undead are Scourge slaves and has his minions attack anyone who approaches him. But because he is Forsaken
column3: the Queen will want him. And if he is skilled in Necromancy
column4: then his knowledge would be...quite useful to us. To discover his identity and his talents
column5: I must see his spellbook. Steal into his camp and acquire it
column6: then return to me.

column1: Graverobbers^8^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Magistrate Sevren^Magistrate Sevren^^^Forsaken Duties
column2: The Prodigal Lich^Kill Rot Hide Graverobbers and Rot Hide Mongrels.^The Mass Graves
column3: southwest of Garren's Haunt to the north
column4: were made to accommodate the...impressive...number of deaths Tirisfal suffered when the Plague first came. The bodies in these graves have so far been spared an undeath
column5: but the Scourge now send Rot Hide Gnolls to gather the corpses and use them to bolster their armies. This cannot be allowed! Your task is twofold: slay the Rot Hides at the Mass Grave and Garren's Haunt
column6: and gather from them the Embalming Ichor that gives them life.

column1: Forsaken Duties^9^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Magistrate Sevren^Deathguard Linnea^Forsaken Duties^Graverobbers^^Speak with Deathguard Linnea.^I need a fresh report from our Deathguard waystation to the east. I must know if more Scourge forces have slipped past The Bulwark and into Tirisfal. Our vigilance on the border to the Plaguelands must be maintained - we can't let the Scourge get a stronger foothold here! Travel south along the road
column2: then east at the fork to the waystation. Speak with Deathguard Linnea. She has the information I need.

column1: Return to the Magistrate^9^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Deathguard Linnea^Magistrate Sevren^Forsaken Duties^^^Return to Magistrate Sevren in Brill.^Now return to Magistrate Sevren with the information I gave you. He'll want it as soon as possible
column2: so be swift. And if you see any Scourge on your way back
column3: take them down - we can't let them wander our lands unchallenged.

column1: A Letter Undelivered^7^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^A Letter to Yvette^Yvette Farthing^^^^Find Yvette Farthing
column2: and deliver to her the letter from Thurman Agamand.^This is a letter written by Thurman
column3: the eldest son of Gregor Agamand. It is addressed to an Yvette Farthing
column4: though it does not appear to have reached her...

column1: The Haunted Mills^10^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Coleman Farthing^Coleman Farthing^^^^Slay Devlin Agamand
column2: and bring Devlin's Remains to Coleman Farthing in Brill.^Devlin Agamand was the younger of two sons in the Agamand family
column3: and in life the two could not be more different. Thurman was tall and gentle while his younger brother was weak and sharp tongued. When Agamand Mills fell to the Plague
column4: I was not surprised to hear that Devlin was quick to succumb. His mad chattering can still be heard near the road leading to the Agamand Mills. I'm collecting the remains of the Agamands
column5: and I want poor Devlin. Find him
column6: destroy him
column7: and bring me his bones.

column1: Rude Awakening^1^Undead^Tirisfal Glades^Undertaker Mordo^Shadow Priest Sarvis^Rude Awakening^^^Speak with Shadow Priest Sarvis.^About time you woke up. We were ready to toss you into the fire with the others
column2: but it looks like you made it. I am Mordo
column3: the caretaker of the crypt of Deathknell. And you are the Lich King's slave no more. Speak with Shadow Priest Sarvis in the chapel at the base of the hill
column4: he will tell you more of what you must know. To get out of this crypt
column5: take the steps up to the surface. Follow the road down to the chapel to find Sarvis.

column1: The Mindless Ones^2^All^Tirisfal Glades^Shadow Priest Sarvis^Shadow Priest Sarvis^Rude Awakening^^Simple Scroll
column2: Tainted Scroll
column3: Rattling the Rattlecages^Shadow Priest Sarvis wants you to kill 5 Mindless Zombies and 5 Wretched Ghouls.^We Forsaken are at war with the Lich King's army of the Scourge: necromantically raised armies of the undead
column4: foul beasts of the north
column5: and tormented spectres. The northern part of the village has become overrun with the Mindless Ones
column6: and they must be destroyed. Destroy them
column7: show them no mercy
column8: our former brothers and sisters as they might be. The Fallen are nothing but The Lich King's slaves.

column1: Fields of Grief^7^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Deathguard Simmer^Apothecary Johaan^Fields of Grief^^^Steal 10 pumpkins from the farm to the west
column2: just north of Deathknell and take them to Apothecary Johaan in Brill.^What have we here? You look like a fledgling <class>. If you hope to prove yourself to The Dark Lady
column3: you need to learn the ways of The Forsaken. To the west you'll find a farm. Humans infest the land like mold on a rotting corpse. And worse yet
column4: the Scarlet Crusade patrols nearby from their tower. Teach those scum a lesson and steal 10 of their precious pumpkins. Once you have 10
column5: take them to Apothecary Johaan in Brill.

column1: Return the Book^8^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Bethor Iceshard^Gunther Arcanus^The Prodigal Lich^^^Return Gunther's Spellbook to him
column2: on the island of Gunther's Retreat.^Long ago Gunther and I
column3: along with the now Scourge Necromancer Thule Ravenclaw
column4: were friends and students within the Kirin Tor - a society of mages in Dalaran. Gunther and I both fell to the Plague
column5: but I thought he either remained dead
column6: or was raised into the ranks of the Lich King. It is good to know he is free. We must have him. I have placed a spell on his book that
column7: when he sees it
column8: will show him that I too am free of the Lich King. After knowing this
column9: it is my hope that he will join us.

column1: A New Plague^6^All^Tirisfal Glades^Apothecary Johaan^Apothecary Johaan^A New Plague^^^Apothecary Johaan in the town of Brill wants you to collect 5 Vials of Darkhound Blood.^Lady Sylvanas has called upon the Royal Apothecary Society. The Dark Lady believes our knowledge coupled with the newfound magic will provide the key to Arthas's demise. She has challenged us to concoct a new plague
column2: a plague deadlier than any ailment on Azeroth. This new disease will bring Arthas's Scourge Army to ruin. My studies show that the blood of beasts might prove to be the key. Bring to me 5 vials of darkhound blood so I can test my theory.

column1: A New Plague^9^All^Tirisfal Glades^Apothecary Johaan^Apothecary Johaan^A New Plague^^^Apothecary Johaan of the town of Brill needs 5 Vile Fin Scales from Murlocs in Tirisfal Glades.^While you were collecting samples for me
column2: my experiments led me to realize that more reagents will be required for this new disease to spread properly. Poisoning some hapless victim is child's play. Plaguing an entire world proves to be a bit more complicated. I will need 5 Vile Fin Scales from Murlocs in the vicinity. You will find the creatures along the coast to the north or to the west.

column1: A New Plague^11^All^Tirisfal Glades^Apothecary Johaan^Apothecary Johaan^A New Plague^^Hallowed Scroll
column2: Glyphic Scroll^Apothecary Johaan in the town of Brill wants you to bring him 4 samples of venom from a Vicious Night Web Spider.^While you were out gathering
column3: I uncovered some old text in one of my tomes that indicates that an ancient plague wiped out thousands of innocent victims. Later it was discovered that the deadly agent in the plague was preserved through the venom of Night Web Spiders. Bring me some venom from a Vicious Night Web Spider to complete this experiment. I want to see if the contagious element from the venom will work with my new concoction. Rumor has it the spiders can be found in Eastern Tirisfal Glades.

column1: At War With The Scarlet Crusade^9^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Executor Zygand^Executor Zygand^At War With The Scarlet Crusade^^^Executor Zygand in Brill wants you to kill Captain Perrine
column2: 3 Scarlet Zealots and 3 Scarlet Missionaries.^The strategic documents from Executor Arren contain all the details we need to wipe the human infestation from the lands. According to the information
column3: The Scarlet Crusade has assigned Captain Perrine and a brigade to the ruined tower southwest of Brill. Kill Perrine along with 3 Zealots and 3 Missionaries and report back to me.

column1: At War With The Scarlet Crusade^10^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Executor Zygand^Executor Zygand^At War With The Scarlet Crusade^^^Executor Zygand in Brill has commissioned you to slay Captain Vachon and 5 Scarlet Friars.^We are still at war and the Scarlet Crusade grows in strength. The report Executor Arren sent me indicates Scarlet Crusaders have been raiding from the ruined tower in southeastern Tirisfal near the Balnir Farmstead under the command of Captain Vachon. Kill Vachon along with 5 Scarlet Friars. It should prove to be a devastating blow to the Crusade!

At War With The Scarlet Crusade^12^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Executor Zygand^Executor Zygand^At War With The Scarlet Crusade^^^Executor Zygand in the town of Brill wants you to assassinate Captain Melrache and his two bodyguards.^Scarlet Crusaders have been raiding from the ruined tower in northern Tirisfal
column2: past Faol's Rest. According to the information we have
column3: a ruthless commander named Captain Melrache is in charge of this evil crew. I am entrusting you now with a special and dangerous mission. Slay Melrache and his two bodyguards
column4: in the name of The Dark Lady.

column1: The Unsent Letter^22^Alliance^Stormwind City^An Unsent Letter^Baros Alexston^The Unsent Letter^^^Deliver the Letter to the City Architect to Baros Alexston in Stormwind.^Searching Edwin VanCleef's person
column2: you discover
column3: among other things
column4: an unsent letter. It is addressed to Baros Alexston
column5: the City Architect of Stormwind
column6: City Hall
column7: Cathedral Square. It appears to be recently written and sealed.

column1: Proof of Demise^7^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Deathguard Burgess^Deathguard Burgess^^^^Bring 10 Scarlet Insignia Rings to Deathguard Burgess in Brill.^Executor Zygand tells me you've been out killing Scarlet Crusaders. Tirisfal Glades is crawling with them. Varimathras
column2: lieutenant to The Dark Lady
column3: is seeing to it personally that the scum of Azeroth
column4: the Human race
column5: gets wiped into oblivion. Here in Tirisfal Glades we face a particularly annoying breed of humans: The Scarlet Crusade. Venture forth and wage an offensive on the Scarlet Crusade
column6: <class>. Bring me back 10 Scarlet Insignia Rings as proof of your loyalty to Varimathras and The Dark Lady.

column1: The Chill of Death^8^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Gretchen Dedmar^Gretchen Dedmar^^^^Bring five Duskbat Pelts and some Coarse Thread to Gretchen Dedmar in Brill.^It's so cold
column2: now. The Plague of Undeath crawls through my veins like an icy serpent. The Mindless State will be upon me soon. But no doomed destiny will prevent me from serving our Dark Lady. When the call arose I sewed body bags for the fallen soldiers of Sylvanas's mighty army. Now my hands shake from the chill. If you would bring me five Duskbat Pelts and some Coarse Thread I could sew myself a blanket. Help me
column3: <name>
column4: so that I can continue to serve the cause.

column1: The Damned^2^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Novice Elreth^Novice Elreth^^^Night Web's Hollow
column2: Scavenging Deathknell
column3: Marla's Last Wish^Novice Elreth requires 6 Scavenger Paws and 6 Duskbat Wings.^My duties include tending to our wounded warriors
column4: tailoring armor and clothes
column5: and assisting Shadow Priest Sarvis with whatever else he might need. From the look of it
column6: you'll be enlisted in his service also... hunting the Mindless Ones
column7: if I know his mind. Well
column8: if you'd like to stay in one piece--and I've no doubt you do--perhaps I can help. I'm running out of paws and wings
column9: and if you bring me some
column10: I'll find some armor for you. You'll find a good number of wolves and bats to the south.

column1: Crime and Punishment^26^Alliance^The Stockade^Councilman Millstipe^Councilman Millstipe^^^^Councilman Millstipe of Darkshire wants you to bring him the hand of Dextren Ward.^As if the neglect for the residents of Duskwood was not bad enough
column2: now the House of Nobles spits in the eye of the Darkshire Council with their decision to imprison Dextren Ward in Stormwind rather than behead the villain as per Lord Ebonlocke's sentence. Ward was caught selling bodies from the cemetery to Morbent Fel
column3: a crime punishable by death. Yet Stormwind claims Ward as their prisoner. Assassinate Ward in The Stormwind Stockade - bring me his hand - and I shall reward you.

column1: The Fury Runs Deep^27^Alliance^The Stockade^Motley Garmason^Motley Garmason^^The Dark Iron War^^Motley Garmason wants Kam Deepfury's head brought to him at Dun Modr.^You have proven your loyalty to King Magni
column2: <class>. And your hatred for the Dark Iron scum is as great as my own. There is a task I wish to complete myself but I am bound by honor to stay with Longbraid. But Roggo has gathered intelligence that proves Kam Deepfury was a conspirator in the attack on the Thandol Span. It was by Deepfury's planning that Longbraid lost his kin. Deepfury is being held for political reasons in the Stormwind Stockade. I want him dead
column3: <name>. For Longbraid! Bring me his head!

column1: Slake That Thirst^46^Horde^Tanaris^Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle^Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle^Errand for Apothecary Zinge^^Tanaris Field Sampling
column2: Another Power Source?^Bring 5 Wastewander Water Pouches to Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle in Gadgetzan.^You want a power source. I can help you with that. Know what I want? I want something to drink! Bring me five Wastewander Water Pouches
column3: and I'll give you the 4711-FTZ. Now... guess where you can find Wastewander Water Pouches! Why don't you walk up to one of the Wastewander nomads to the east of here and ask them for one. Let me know how that works out for you.

column1: Night Web's Hollow^4^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Executor Arren^Executor Arren^Night Web's Hollow^The Damned^^Executor Arren wants you to kill 8 Young Night Web Spiders and 5 Night Web Spiders.^One of our greatest struggles is obtaining the natural resources we need to survive. Gold was scarce even in the height of the Alliance's power. There is a gold mine to the northwest that has been overrun with spiders. We need gold from the mine
column2: but we can't very well get it while the spiders are crawling around in there. I've not much manpower to commit to the task
column3: so we'll just have to do it little by little. Get up there and see what you can do for us
column4: <name>.

column1: The Scarlet Crusade^4^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Executor Arren^Executor Arren^Night Web's Hollow^^^Bring Executor Arren 12 Scarlet Armbands from Scarlet Converts and Scarlet Initiates.^You'll be happy to know we appear to be making progress in the mine
column2: thanks in no small part to your efforts. We can now turn our eyes to other concerns. My scouts have reported that a detachment of the Scarlet Crusade is setting up a camp southeast of here. The Scarlet Crusade is a despicable organization that hunts us
column3: and they will not rest until every undead--Lich King's Scourge or no--is destroyed. We must strike first! Be careful
column4: their unholy zeal makes them dangerous adversaries.

column1: The Red Messenger^5^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Executor Arren^Executor Arren^Night Web's Hollow^^Vital Intelligence^Kill Meven Korgal
column2: the messenger
column3: at the Crusader camp
column4: then return any information you find to Executor Arren.^Reports from my superiors in Brill indicate that an agent of the Scarlet Crusade was dispatched from the Scarlet Monastery and sent here to Deathknell. According to the reports
column5: the messenger possesses important information on his person. I do not have further details
column6: but whatever it is
column7: we must have it! You're the most qualified person I have to send
column8: <name>. Find that messenger and bring me whatever information you can find.

column1: Vital Intelligence^5^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Executor Arren^Executor Zygand^^The Red Messenger^At War With The Scarlet Crusade^Deliver the Scarlet Crusade Documents to Executor Zygand in Brill.^These will need to be taken to my superior
column2: Executor Zygand
column3: in Brill. With this information
column4: we'll be able to deal a decisive blow to the Scarlet Crusade. Your services have been useful here in Deathknell
column5: but I need someone to deliver this to Zygand
column6: and I believe he'll be able to find you more appropriate work. Take the road north out of Deathknell. Soon after entering Tirisfal proper
column7: you'll hit a crossroads. Take the eastern fork
column8: and keep going east. You'll pass Cold Hearth Manor along the way.

column1: Beer Basted Boar Ribs^7^Alliance^Cooking^Ragnar Thunderbrew^Ragnar Thunderbrew^^^^Ragnar Thunderbrew in Kharanos wants 6 Crag Boar Ribs and a mug of Rhapsody Malt.^Nothing my tavern patrons enjoy more than some Beer Basted Boar Ribs! Only problem is
column2: the local trapper who used to bring me supplies enlisted in the King's Army to help with the war on the Alliance front. Maybe you can help me out? If you bring me six crag boar ribs and a Rhapsody Malt from the tavern here
column3: I'll give you the family recipe for my famous Beer Basted Boar Ribs
column4: not to mention a free sample! The secret's in the Malt!

column1: Crocolisk Hunting^15^Alliance^Loch Modan^Marek Ironheart^Marek Ironheart^^^^Get 5 pieces of Crocolisk Meat and 6 Crocolisk Skins for Marek Ironheart at the Farstrider Lodge.^Many a hunter is attracted to Loch Modan to hunt our famous crocs. There are always merchants who seek out crocolisk skins for clothing items or armor
column2: and there are also some who enjoy the taste of their meat. We do some trade in this
column3: but not a huge amount
column4: as the crocolisks are ferocious and have entrenched themselves on the islands in the Loch. But don't let me dissuade you
column5: it's quite an experience
column6: wrestling with the jaws of the beasts. Why
column7: this one time...

column1: What Comes Around...^25^Alliance^The Stockade^Guard Berton^Guard Berton^^^^Bring the head of Targorr the Dread to Guard Berton in Lakeshire.^Targorr the Dread served under Gath'Ilzogg as supreme Executioner. His methods were ruthless
column2: even by filthy orc standards. Men who fought bravely to defend the Kingdom were tortured on his whim. Now he is being held in the Stormwind Stockade
column3: sentenced to die. Yet something is amiss. One of the bureaucratic nobles put a hold on his execution. I am sure foul play is in the works. Put an end to Targorr the Dread
column4: <name>. Travel to The Stockade and behead him before trickery is upon us.

column1: Quell The Uprising^26^Alliance^The Stockade^Warden Thelwater^Warden Thelwater^^^^Warden Thelwater of Stormwind wants you to kill 10 Defias Prisoners
column2: 8 Defias Convicts
column3: and 8 Defias Insurgents in The Stockade.^The uprising must be quelled! I need your assistance. If word gets out that the prison is overrun I will lose my job! This is a case of foul play if I've ever seen one. But what's important now is forcing these prisoners into submission for the safety of Stormwind. The punishment for insurgency is death. Kill some of these deviants! That ought to get things under control.

column1: The Color of Blood^26^Alliance^The Stockade^Nikova Raskol^Nikova Raskol^^^^Nikova Raskol of Stormwind wants you to collect 10 Red Wool Bandanas.^Bitterness flows through my veins like a cold river. My grandson
column2: Mac
column3: was such a good boy. A mere 14 years old. When the army was sent off to the front
column4: Mac took up arms to defend the city. He was a guard in The Stockade
column5: where the Defias gang is locked up. Mac reprimanded some of the prisoners for tearing their wool blankets to make scarves
column6: a symbol of their gang. For that Mac was stabbed in the back. I want revenge. Bring me 10 of their precious Wool Bandanas. They are the color of blood.

column1: Bazil Thredd^22^Alliance^Stormwind City^Baros Alexston^Warden Thelwater^The Unsent Letter^^^Speak with Warden Thelwater in the Stockade.^VanCleef and I were members of the Stonemasons Guild. Our main project was to rebuild Stormwind after the War. When we had finished our duties
column2: we were cheated. The nobles refused to pay us for our work. Some of the more senior of the Stonemasons were offered governmental jobs
column3: but VanCleef refused it out of loyalty to all the Stonemasons. He led a riot and left the city
column4: swearing revenge. His lieutenant
column5: Bazil Thredd
column6: might know more about VanCleef's plans. He's being held prisoner in the Stockade.

column1: The Stockade Riots^29^Alliance^The Stockade^Warden Thelwater^Warden Thelwater^The Unsent Letter^^^Kill Bazil Thredd and bring his head back to Warden Thelwater at the Stockade.^Let's get one thing straight
column2: <name>: I don't trust you. But
column3: with the situation as it is
column4: you probably won't make a difference. So here's how it's going to be: go down there and have your talk with Thredd. If you're really on our side
column5: then kill him and bring me his head when the job's done. And if it turns out you're on his side
column6: and don't come out... when we find you
column7: you'll die along with the rest of the maggots.

column1: The Curious Visitor^29^Alliance^Stormwind City^Warden Thelwater^Baros Alexston^The Unsent Letter^^^Bring the Sealed Description of Thredd's Visitor to Baros Alexston in Stormwind.^of Thredd's Visitor to Baros Alexston in Stormwind.	Sealed Description of Thredd's Visitor(Provided)Relevant LocationsThe entirety of this quest happens in Stormwind City.Tip: Click map to zoomTip: Click map to zoomTip: Click map to zoomTip: Click map to zoomTip: Click map to zoomTip: Click map to zoomTip: Click map to zoomTip: Click map to zoomTip: Click map to zoomHide pinsHide pinsStormwind CityStormwind CityStormwind CityStormwind CityStormwind CityStormwind CityStormwind CityStormwind CityStormwind CityDescriptionDuring the first years of Thredd's imprisonment, he never had any visitors. I figured that he was no longer of use to the Brotherhood, so they abandoned him. Anyway, a few months ago, that all changed; he started to get regular visits... once, maybe twice a week. It was a strange man--the quiet type. I had my suspicions, but all his papers checked out. His documents claimed his name was Maelik; here's his description. I don't think he'll be coming to visit Thredd anymore.

Shadow of the Past^29^Alliance^Stormwind City^Baros Alexston^Master Mathias Shaw^The Unsent Letter^^^Bring the Sealed Description of Thredd's Visitor to Master Mathias Shaw in Stormwind.^of Thredd's Visitor to Master Mathias Shaw in Stormwind.	Sealed Description of Thredd's Visitor(Provided)Relevant LocationsThe entirety of this quest happens in Stormwind City.Tip: Click map to zoomTip: Click map to zoomTip: Click map to zoomTip: Click map to zoomTip: Click map to zoomTip: Click map to zoomTip: Click map to zoomTip: Click map to zoomTip: Click map to zoomHide pinsHide pinsStormwind CityStormwind CityStormwind CityStormwind CityStormwind CityStormwind CityStormwind CityStormwind CityStormwind CityDescriptionI really haven't a clue, <name>. There is someone else who might be able to help you, and it so happens that he owes me a favor for--well, let's not get into that. Master Mathias Shaw of SI:7 can be found in the barracks in Old Town. Shaw has his thumb on most of the shady, or underhanded dealings of the city. If anyone knows, it'd be him.

The Head of the Beast^31^Alliance^Stormwind City^Elling Trias^Master Mathias Shaw^The Attack!^^^Speak to Mathias Shaw in Stormwind.^Find Shaw in Old Town. Let him know that the Lescovar threat has been dealt with and about your involvement in the Lord's plots against the city. I'm sure he'll be proud to have another hero among Stormwind's citizens. He'll more than likely send you off to meet with the Prince or some other noble. Don't let it get to your head
column2: <name>. The nobles can think they rule the city all they want
column3: but some things remain out of their hands.

column1: Brotherhood's End^31^Alliance^Stormwind City^Master Mathias Shaw^Baros Alexston^The Attack!^^^Speak with Baros Alexston in Stormwind.^Ah
column2: I almost forgot. Alexston came while you were away
column3: he wished to speak with you. No doubt he wishes to report the goings-on of the Defias Brotherhood to the nobles. A bit of advice
column4: <name>: if anyone should ask
column5: I would provide all details but that it was your hand that slew Lescovar. Trust me. I am... acquainted... with the ways of such things. And as far as Trias goes
column6: well
column7: speak to no one of him... ever... if you can help it.

column1: An Audience with the King^31^Alliance^Stormwind City^Baros Alexston^King Varian Wrynn^The Attack!^^^Deliver Baros Alexston's report on the Defias Brotherhood to King Varian Wrynn in Stormwind Keep.^I have prepared a report for the King. I believe you should be the one to deliver it to him
column2: along with an account of your findings. Do not worry
column3: there is no doubt that he will commend you for doing your duty to the people of Stormwind. Your audience is scheduled soon
column4: so you'd best hurry
column5: it's a bit of a ways to Stormwind Keep.

column1: You Have Served Us Well^30^Alliance^Warlock^Zardeth of the Black Claw^Zggi^^A Noble Brew^^Speak with Zggi
column2: the servant of Zardeth the Blackclaw
column3: to claim your reward.^I hear Lord Wishock enjoyed his beverage. You have served us well
column4: <name>. The Warlocks of Stormwind will be able to practice our ways without disturbance
column5: thanks to you. For your efforts
column6: I have prepared a special gift for you. Speak with my servant
column7: Zggi
column8: and claim your reward.

column1: Wanted: Maggot Eye^10^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Wanted!^Executor Zygand^^^^Kill Maggot Eye and return to Executor Zygand in Brill with his paw for a reward.^Wanted: Maggot Eye! A foul beast
column2: even by Gnoll standards
column3: Maggot Eye has been sentenced to death for his crimes against The Forsaken. This despicable villain has been stealing corpses for use by the Lich King's army. Maggot Eye was last seen pillaging the lands near Garren's Haunt to the north of Brill. The town of Brill hereby offers a reward to the capable soul who can carry out the execution. Show Executor Zygand the villain's paw once the deed is done. Mercy is for the weak.

column1: Humble Beginnings^15^Alliance^Stormwind City^Baros Alexston^Baros Alexston^^^^Go to Baros Alexston's house in Westfall and search for his compass
column2: then return it to him in Cathedral Square of Stormwind.^It seems an eternity since I was a boy working the farm in Westfall. They say you can never go back
column3: and it's true. Doubly true in my case
column4: my family's home has been burned down and taken over by thieves. I have spoken with my father about the fate of some of my possessions
column5: including my first compass. He was unable to save them. However
column6: he also says that they should be hidden away on the farm. You'll find the Alexston Farmstead west of Sentinel Hill. Perhaps you could go and retrieve it for me?

column1: Tools for Steelgrill^5^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Tharek Blackstone^Beldin Steelgrill^^^^Deliver Steelgrill's Tools to Beldin Steelgrill.^Beldin Steelgrill owns the local mechanic shop
column2: and he's the best siege engine tech there is! But he's not forgiving to his tools. I swear he almost breaks more arclight spanners than we can supply him with! We just filled his last order for tools. If you deliver it to him I'm sure he'll make it worth the effort. His shop
column3: Steelgrill's Depot
column4: is just northeast of Kharanos. And it's a local haunt for veteran siege engine pilots
column5: so keep your ears open for opportunities while you're there.

column1: Wait for Sirra to Finish^30^Alliance^Duskwood^Sirra Von'Indi^Sirra Von'Indi^Wait for Sirra to Finish^Translate Abercrombie's Note^^Wait a moment
column2: then speak with Sirra Von'Indi again.^I'm almost finished translating that note. If you come back in a few moments I should be done.

column1: A Putrid Task^6^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Deathguard Dillinger^Deathguard Dillinger^^^The Mills Overrun^Bring 7 Putrid Claws to Deathguard Dillinger in Brill.^Scourge have trickled into Tirisfal Glades and have infested the area west of Brill
column2: near the old bridge. Go there and beat back the rotting dead and ravaged corpses you find. Scatter their bones and bring back their putrid claws
column3: and the Deathguards will reward you.

column1: The Prodigal Lich^8^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Magistrate Sevren^Bethor Iceshard^The Prodigal Lich^Graverobbers^^Present Sevren's Orders to Bethor Iceshard in the Undercity.^Bethor Iceshard
column2: a high-ranking and powerful mage in the Undercity to the south
column3: commands me to send him an agent with proven worth against the Scourge. You
column4: <name>
column5: will be that agent. Present these orders to Bethor. He will then instruct you on your mission. I don't know its details
column6: but it deals with recruiting a wayward Lich. And it will be dangerous. So ready yourself
column7: <class>. You must not fail. You may find Bethor in the Magic Quarter of the Undercity.

column1: Fields of Grief^7^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Apothecary Johaan^Captured Scarlet Zealot^Fields of Grief^^^Take the Laced Pumpkin to the Captured Scarlet Zealot who is being held in the cellar of the Gallow's End Tavern.^Harmless pumpkins
column2: right? Or so it would seem. If we are to defeat Arthas's advances from the North and the Human infestation from the South we need to start realizing the full potential of our gift of undeath. With a little ingenuity a simple pumpkin becomes an agent for our Dark Lady. This pumpkin
column3: laced with my latest formula
column4: will prove to be quite a treat. Yet another Scarlet Zealot has been captured and is being kept in the cellar of the Gallow's End Tavern. Take this pumpkin to the fool.

column1: The Family Crypt^13^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Magistrate Sevren^Magistrate Sevren^Speak with Sevren^^^Kill 8 Wailing Ancestors and 8 Rotting Ancestors.^The Agamand Mills area has become a foothold for the Scourge. Their strongest point is the Agamand Family Crypt where their local military leader
column2: a skeleton named Captain Dargol
column3: has headquartered. With Necromancy he has raised the ancestors of the Agamands and plans to use them against us. This cannot pass
column4: and you must stop it. Travel to the Agamand Family Crypt and defeat the raised Agamand ancestors. And
column5: bring me the skull of Captain Dargol.

column1: Proving Allegiance^12^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Gunther Arcanus^Gunther Arcanus^The Prodigal Lich^^^Obtain a Candle of Beckoning.^You say you are not bound by the will of the Lich King
column2: and the enchantment Bethor placed upon my book corroborates this. But before I believe you I must have proof that you are enemy to the Scourge. There is an old
column3: bloody altar just off the southern coast of this island. it is used by a powerful Scourge agent
column4: Lillith Nefara. Take a Candle of Beckoning from this crate here. Light it on the altar and Lillith will awake. Destroy Lillith
column5: and I will believe you are the Lich King's foe.

column1: The Prodigal Lich Returns^12^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Gunther Arcanus^Bethor Iceshard^The Prodigal Lich^^^Bring the Nether Gem to Bethor Iceshard in the Undercity.^Take this Nether Gem to my old comrade Bethor. It will let us communicate ... and I have much to tell him.

Operation Recombobulation^10^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Razzle Sprysprocket^Razzle Sprysprocket^^^^Bring Razzle Sprysprocket in Kharanos 8 Restabilization Cogs and 8 Gyromechanic Gears.^Upon further analysis of the Gnomeregan situation
column2: it would appear as though we not only failed to eradicate the troggs but we also happened to turn most of the gnomish race into horrific
column3: mindless
column4: evil-doing leper gnomes. Ozzie and I plan to reverse the horrible leper effect with our latest invention: The Recombobulator. The machine is almost complete but we are in dire need of some Restabilization Cogs and Gyromechanic Gears. Retrieve some from the leper gnomes out front of Gnomeregan for us.

column1: Shimmer Stout^10^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Rejold Barleybrew^Mountaineer Barleybrew^Rejold's New Brew^^^Take the Barrel of Shimmer Stout to Mountaineer Barleybrew.^I'd like my brother Wellart to try my new Shimmer Stout. He's a Mountaineer stationed in the southern guard tower
column2: one of two towers on the border to Loch Modan. He may not be a brewer like the rest of us Barleybrews
column3: but he loves his drinks and I know he'll like this one. Can you bring him this Barrel of Shimmer Stout for me?

column1: Stout to Kadrell^10^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Mountaineer Barleybrew^Mountaineer Kadrell^Rejold's New Brew^^^Take the Cask of Shimmer Stout to Mountaineer Kadrell in Loch Modan.^I've been drinking more of that Shimmer Stout my brother made - it's great stuff! I want a fellow Mountaineer to try it. His name's Kadrell
column2: and he's usually patrolling the road through Thelsamar in Loch Modan. To get to Thelsamar
column3: go southeast through the tunnel
column4: then turn northeast when the path forks into a road. Follow that road straight into Thelsamar. Give Mountaineer Kadrell this cask of Shimmer Stout and see what he thinks!

column1: Rejold's New Brew^10^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Tharek Blackstone^Rejold Barleybrew^Rejold's New Brew^The Perfect Stout^^Speak with Rejold Barleybrew.^Rejold Barleybrew at Brewnall Village has been asking for you. He wants to talk to you about a new drink he's been brewing...said something about you helping him with it. You might want to head back to Brewnall Village and see what he has to say. There could be some free booze in it for you...

Rat Catching^11^Alliance^Loch Modan^Mountaineer Kadrell^Mountaineer Kadrell^^^^Bring 12 Tunnel Rat Ears to Mountaineer Kadrell in Thelsamar.^We have a real infestation problem to the west. Tunnel rat kobolds have moved into the foothills
column2: setting up dens and fouling our land with their filth! We want them eliminated. Hunt them
column3: bring me their ears and earn their bounty. You can find tunnel rat kobolds and their dens west of Thelsamar
column4: littered along the mountainside.

column1: A Pilot's Revenge^11^Alliance^Dun Morogh^A Dwarven Corpse^Pilot Hammerfoot^The Lost Pilot^^^Kill Mangeclaw.^Hildelve wrote in his journal that he was attacked by Mangeclaw
column2: a "huge Ice Claw Bear." He drove off the beast
column3: but not before it mauled him savagely. Judging from the state of Hildelve's body
column4: Mangeclaw must have later returned and killed him. However
column5: Hildelve wrote in his journal his one
column6: final wish: Revenge against Mangeclaw.

column1: Thelsamar Blood Sausages^11^Alliance^Loch Modan^Vidra Hearthstove^Vidra Hearthstove^^^^Bring 3 pieces of Bear Meat
column2: 3 Boar Intestines
column3: and 3 Spider Ichor to Vidra Hearthstove in Thelsamar.^There's never a shortage of empty bellies here in Thelsamar
column4: kids running in and out
column5: workers from the excavation coming in after a hard day's work. We're famous for our blood sausages
column6: I don't suppose you've ever tried them? No? Well
column7: around here you've got to work for your meals
column8: and don't think just because you're a fancy <class>
column9: you'll be any exception. I'll need bear meat
column10: boar intestines for the casings
column11: and spider ichor for spice. You get me some of those
column12: and leave the cooking to Vidra!

column1: The Lost Pilot^10^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Pilot Hammerfoot^A Dwarven Corpse^The Lost Pilot^^^Find Pilot Hildelve.^My friend and fellow Siege Engine pilot
column2: Mori Hildelve
column3: is lost in the hills. We were looking for a rare ore that's needed for a high-grade blastpowder
column4: and during our search he drove his engine up a steep hill and busted it! Still convinced that ore was in these mountains
column5: Hildelve charged me to guard our engines while he continued on foot
column6: searching. It's been days
column7: and I've heard some beastly growls in the hills at night. Mori's tough as nails
column8: but I'm worried. Please
column9: <name>. Find him.

column1: Senir's Observations^5^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Mountaineer Thalos^Senir Whitebeard^^Senir's Observations^Frostmane Hold^Deliver Grelin's report to Senir Whitebeard in Kharanos.^The troggs in the tunnel are extremely hostile
column2: and haven't shown any hesitation in attacking travelers through the tunnel. You seem tough enough
column3: though
column4: so you should probably be safe. Directions? If you're going to speak with Senir
column5: you'll find him in Kharanos. Make your way through the tunnel
column6: and after you come out on the other side
column7: just keep following the road
column8: it'll run right into Kharanos.

column1: Prove Your Worth^10^All^Silverpine Forest^Dalar Dawnweaver^Dalar Dawnweaver^Prove Your Worth^^^Dalar Dawnweaver at the Sepulcher wants you to kill 5 Moonrage Whitescalps.^Lady Sylvanas has charged Varimathras with the conquering of the human and dwarven lands to the south. But that fool
column2: Arugal -- charlatan of Dalaran and now cursed beast of Shadowfang Keep -- let his reckless magic wreak havoc with the strategic stronghold of Silverpine Forest. I need someone skilled in the ways of combat to help clean up Arugal's mess. Prove yourself to me by killing 5 Moonrage Whitescalps. The wretched beasts can often be found just off the road
column3: down the hill below.

column1: Arugal's Folly^11^All^Silverpine Forest^Dalar Dawnweaver^Dalar Dawnweaver^Prove Your Worth^^^Retrieve the Remedy of Arugal for Dalar Dawnweaver at the Sepulcher.^How Arugal gained acceptance within the Kirin Tor is beyond me. His spell-casting knowledge seemed as transparent as a blown glass bauble. What's important now is learning exactly what magic Arugal used so that I can turn it against him and secure Silverpine Forest for the Dark Lady. Arugal first stayed at the wheat farm just north of the bridge. One of the Deathstalkers reported seeing some spellbooks but could not secure them. Retrieve for me the spell labeled Remedy of Arugal from those books.

Arugal's Folly^14^All^Silverpine Forest^Dalar Dawnweaver^Dalar Dawnweaver^Prove Your Worth^^^Bring 6 Glutton Shackles and 3 Darksoul Shackles to Dalar Dawnweaver at the Sepulcher.^After examining Arugal's work my worst suspicions were confirmed. The old hack was not qualified to clean chamber pots in Dalaran let alone represent the Kirin Tor in its most dire hour. Fools! Arugal used enchanted items to reinforce his weak magic. I need to examine these items first hand. Travel forth and slay Moonrage Gluttons and Moonrage Darksouls until you have collected enough of their enchanted shackles for my research. The foul creatures have been seen to the north and east.

Arugal's Folly^15^All^Silverpine Forest^Dalar Dawnweaver^Dalar Dawnweaver^Prove Your Worth^^^Kill Grimson the Pale and bring his head to Dalar Dawnweaver at the Sepulcher.^It will indeed take me longer than I had thought to uncover the dark secrets behind the enchantments Arugal was using. But in the meantime I need you to take care of a slight problem our Darkstalkers have discovered. It seems that Arugal let his magic spread to the Deep Elem Mine in the hills to the southeast. The mine would prove to be quite a resource for Varimathras's advance. I want you to behead the tainted foreman of the mine
column2: Grimson the Pale. With his death
column3: the mine shall be ours.

column1: Ivar the Foul^12^All^Silverpine Forest^Rane Yorick^Rane Yorick^^Return to Quinn^^Kill Ivar the Foul
column2: and bring Ivar's Head to Rane Yorick at the Ivar Patch.^My brother Quinn and I were tasked to recon Silverpine Forest and report to High Executor Hadrec. But we didn't get far -- when moving through this farm we were attacked by the ghoul Ivar the Foul. We escaped from Ivar
column3: but he seriously mauled Quinn. He's healing from the potion you gave him
column4: but Ivar may return before Quinn recovers. Kill Ivar so Quinn will have time to heal. Ivar is usually in the barn yonder
column5: waiting for my guard to drop.

column1: The Mills Overrun^8^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Deathguard Dillinger^Deathguard Dillinger^^A Putrid Task^^Gather 5 Notched Ribs and 3 Blackened Skulls
column2: then return to Deathguard Dillinger in Brill.^The Scourge are trying to form a base at the Agamand Mills. If they do
column3: then they can stage further attacks within Tirisfal. The orders have been given. The Scourge in the Mills must be destroyed. Go to the Mills. Collect Notched Ribs from Rattlecage and Cracked Skull Soldiers
column4: and Blackened Skulls from Darkeye Bonecasters. To get to the Mills
column5: follow the road west. After crossing the bridge
column6: take the next fork north then keep going north. When you see windmills
column7: the battle will begin.

column1: At War With The Scarlet Crusade^8^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Executor Zygand^Executor Zygand^At War With The Scarlet Crusade^Vital Intelligence^^Executor Zygand of Brill wants you to kill 10 Scarlet Warriors.^The documents Executor Arren provided are just the break we needed in our battle with the wretched Scarlet Crusade. We now know their exact locations throughout Tirisfal Glades. But the Deathguard has larger concerns. The Lich King's army grows in number each night. We need someone with "initiative" like yourself to drive the Scarlet Crusade to the grave. Prove to me you are capable of serving The Dark Lady by travelling west to the tower past the Solliden Farmstead and slay 10 Scarlet Warriors.
Lost Deathstalkers^12^All^Silverpine Forest^High Executor Hadrec^Rane Yorick^Lost Deathstalkers^^^Find the Deathstalkers Quinn and Rane Yorick.^A couple weeks ago two of our Deathstalkers
column2: Rane and Quinn Yorick
column3: were sent on a reconnaissance mission through northern Silverpine. We have not heard from them. They may have become victim to the Scourge
column4: though if that is true then I want it confirmed. Find these Deathstalkers. Their first objective was to scout the farms in northern Silverpine. You should begin your search there.

column1: Wild Hearts^11^All^Silverpine Forest^Rane Yorick^Apothecary Renferrel^Lost Deathstalkers^^^Gather 6 discolored worg hearts and bring them to Apothecary Renferrel at the Sepulcher.^My brother Quinn was badly hurt by the ghoul
column2: Ivar the Foul
column3: and I don't know if he will heal properly without magical aid. Although I am not an apothecary
column4: I do know that our apothecaries can make healing potions from the discolored hearts of worgs. Gather such hearts and take them to Apothecary Renferrel at the Sepulcher to the south. Then return here with the potion. You can find plenty of worgs between here and Malden's Orchard to the east.

column1: Return to Quinn^11^All^Silverpine Forest^Apothecary Renferrel^Quinn Yorick^Lost Deathstalkers^^Ivar the Foul^Bring Quinn's potion to Quinn Yorick at the Ivar Patch
column2: north of the Sepulcher.^Here is the potion to aid in Quinn Yorick's recovery. Now if you will excuse me
column3: I have very important work to continue...

column1: Those Blasted Troggs!^9^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Foreman Stonebrow^Foreman Stonebrow^^^^Kill 6 Rockjaw Skullthumpers for Foreman Stonebrow at the Gol'Bolar quarry.^Those Light-blasted troggs
column2: turning my work site into a wreck! Look at that
column3: there goes another barrel of powder! Ohhh
column4: I wish I could go down there and wring every one of their scrawny little necks! I want to kill them all! This can't be good for my health
column5: all this stress and anger... What have they left me with? Nothing! I'd kill them myself
column6: but my aim's no good anymore! You go into the quarry and kill some of the filthy buggers! I'll pay you! Just hurt them
column7: kill them!

column1: The Public Servant^11^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Senator Mehr Stonehallow^Senator Mehr Stonehallow^^^^Kill 10 Rockjaw Bonesnappers for Senator Mehr Stonehallow at the Gol'Bolar quarry.^As a member of the Senate and the Explorers' League
column2: I've taken it upon myself to take care of this part of the trogg infestation that has gripped our lands. They've certainly made a mess of Gol'Bolar quarry
column3: and for no reason. As we dug deep into the earth
column4: they poured out
column5: destroying our equipment and driving the miners out. There's not much for us to do but to exterminate the lot of them
column6: rebuild
column7: then get back to work. If you help me with the troggs
column8: I'll gladly recompense you for your time.

column1: The Attack!^31^Alliance^Stormwind City^Tyrion^Elling Trias^The Attack!^Items of Some Consequence^^Remain in the garden until Lord Gregor Lescovar and Marzon the Silent Blade have had their conversation. Afterwards
column2: kill them both before returning to Elling Trias in Stormwind.^After I put on Spybot's disguise
column3: he'll head in to talk to Lescovar. The guards should let him pass no problem. While you were getting materials for me
column4: I took care of informing Marzon that it was time for him and Lescovar to meet again. I even dropped some false information. Lescovar will dismiss his guards and wait for Marzon out here in the garden. After you catch wind of talk about the Defias
column5: make your move. You need to kill them both before the guards return! When you're done
column6: speak to Trias.

column1: Escorting Erland^11^All^Silverpine Forest^Deathstalker Erland^Rane Yorick^Escorting Erland^^^Escort Erland through the wolves
column2: to Rane Yorick.^The wolves outside won't leave
column3: and they eye me evilly every time I step foot out that door. They must be incredibly hungry to think I'm worth eating. I have to report to my teammate
column4: the Deathstalker Rane Yorick. And to get to Rane
column5: I'll need help against those wolves. Please escort me! And there are a lot of wolves out there
column6: so we'll have a better chance if you have friends who can help...

column1: Ironband's Excavation^18^Alliance^Loch Modan^Jern Hornhelm^Magmar Fellhew^Ironband's Excavation^^^Speak with Explorer Fellhew.^Prospector Ironband is heading an excavation of ancient ruins east of the lake. His progress has been slow lately
column2: especially considering all the supplies we've sent him. Ironband's a stout
column3: honest dwarf who values results
column4: which has me worried that forces are at work against him. Go to Ironband's Excavation and speak with Magmar Fellhew. He manages the details of the site and will know why there's a slowdown. To get to the excavation site
column5: go around the southern tip of the lake
column6: then head east.

column1: The Dead Fields^14^All^Silverpine Forest^High Executor Hadrec^High Executor Hadrec^The Dead Fields^^^Kill rot hide gnolls at the Dead Fields.^Our initial scouting reports of Silverpine show the rot hides have a base at an old farm to the north
column2: the Dead Fields. We have sent small assaults against them
column3: but each time they are reinforced by the banshee Nightlash
column4: who uses her magic to rout our forces. We want Nightlash destroyed. Go to the Dead Fields and assault the rot hides. If you don't see Nightlash then kill the rot hides until she appears
column5: then defeat her. Her essence will turn to dust. Bring me that dust as proof.

column1: The Decrepit Ferry^16^All^Silverpine Forest^High Executor Hadrec^Corpse Laden Boat^The Dead Fields^^Rot Hide Ichor^Go to the Decrepit Ferry.^<name>
column2: we've discovered a new hive for the Scourge: the Decrepit Ferry. The ferry lies east of the Sepulcher
column3: and is heavily patrolled by rot hides and other undead. There must be a reason for the Scourge's occupation of the area. Go to the Decrepit Ferry and find out why the Scourge are there.

column1: Rot Hide Clues^16^Horde^Silverpine Forest^Corpse Laden Boat^High Executor Hadrec^The Dead Fields^^The Engraved Ring^Bring Deliah's Ring to High Executor Hadrec at the Sepulcher.^Among the corpses a hand protrudes
column2: unwrapped. It is the hand of a woman
column3: pockmarked from the plague but relatively fresh. On the hand is a ring. Removing the ring and inspecting it reveals an engraving: "For Deliah"

column1: The Engraved Ring^16^All^Silverpine Forest^High Executor Hadrec^Magistrate Sevren^The Engraved Ring^Rot Hide Clues^^Bring Deliah's Ring to Magistrate Sevren in Brill.^If you want to find the husband or beloved who gave Deliah her ring... then speak with Magistrate Sevren in Brill. He should have records of recent deaths and
column2: with luck
column3: can discover who Deliah is. But I wouldn't hope. Whoever gave her the ring is probably dead. Or if he's undead he probably no longer cares about Deliah.

column1: Raleigh and the Undercity^16^All^Silverpine Forest^Magistrate Sevren^Raleigh Andrean^The Engraved Ring^^^Bring Deliah's Ring to Raleigh.^Deliah had a husband
column2: Raleigh
column3: who now dwells in the Undercity. If the Deliah who lived in Brill is the one who owned this ring
column4: then Raleigh will know. Raleigh is in the Trade Quarter of the Undercity.

column1: Assault on Fenris Isle^20^All^Silverpine Forest^High Executor Hadrec^High Executor Hadrec^Thule Ravenclaw^^^Bring Thule's Head to High Executor Hadrec at the Sepulcher.^Now is the time to assault the Scourge's place of strength in Silverpine: Fenris Isle. You must again go to the Isle and destroy Thule Ravenclaw. I want his head! This mission is as dangerous as it is vital
column2: <name>. You must not fail.

column1: Rot Hide Ichor^17^All^Silverpine Forest^High Executor Hadrec^Apothecary Renferrel^The Dead Fields^The Decrepit Ferry^^Bring 8 bottles of rot hide ichor to Apothecary Renferrel at the Sepulcher.^Before we launch an assault on Fenris Isle
column2: we must determine who is behind the rot hide gnolls. Our apothecaries believe their origin lies within the strange fluid that flows through their bodies. Go to Fenris Isle
column3: east of the Decrepit Ferry
column4: and collect rot hide ichor from the gnolls you find there. Bring it to Apothecary Renferrel
column5: stationed outside the Sepulcher.

column1: Rot Hide Origins^17^All^Silverpine Forest^Apothecary Renferrel^Bethor Iceshard^The Dead Fields^^Thule Ravenclaw^Bring the Sample Ichor to Bethor Iceshard in the Undercity.^I have reduced the ichor you brought me and separated it into its base components. My findings are not conclusive
column2: but I have determined that warlock and necromantic magics were used in the ichor's creation. While I continue to study the ichor
column3: I want you to take a sample to Bethor Iceshard in the Undercity. Bethor is not an apothecary
column4: but his knowledge of magic may help to unravel the mystery of the rot hides. Go. You will find Bethor in the Magic Quarter of the Undercity.

column1: Delivery to Silverpine Forest^10^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Apothecary Johaan^Apothecary Renferrel^^^^Take Apothecary Johaan's findings to Apothecary Renferrel in Silverpine Forest.^Time is a luxury that is not afforded to those of us under the employ of Lady Sylvanas. Surely you know this by now. As a member of the Royal Apothecary Society it is my duty to share my knowledge with my colleagues so that our collective efforts might one day provide The Dark Lady with the New Plague she so badly desires.
