Take these findings to Apothecary Renferrel who is stationed at The Sepulcher in Silverpine Forest. Follow the roads to the south from Brill. From the Undercity go southwest.

Thule Ravenclaw^16^All^Silverpine Forest^Bethor Iceshard^Apothecary Renferrel^Thule Ravenclaw^Rot Hide Origins^^Bring Bethor's Scroll to Apothecary Renferrel at the Silverpine Sepulcher.^This Ichor was crafted by an old colleague of mine: Thule Ravenclaw. He was a young
column2: promising mage before the great war
column3: but when the Lich King rose to power
column4: he betrayed his brethren and allied with the Scourge. I did not realize he still lives
column5: nor that he leads the Rot Hides in their forays against us! I know many of his spells
column6: and can help concoct a potion to counter them. Take this scroll back to Apothecary Renferrel. It has the incantations needed for the potion.

column1: A Recipe For Death^12^All^Silverpine Forest^Apothecary Renferrel^Master Apothecary Faranell^A Recipe For Death^^^Collect 6 Grizzled Bear Hearts and 6 samples of Skittering Blood and deliver them to Master Apothecary Faranell in the Undercity.^Arthas's numbers are overwhelming. But with a New Plague we could eradicate both the Scourge Army and the Human infestation once and for all. My studies have proven that spider blood combined with a toxin derived from a grizzled bear heart results in a deadly elixir. Collect samples from the spiders in the Skittering Dark to the northwest and from the bears wandering throughout Silverpine Forest. Deliver the reagents to Master Apothecary Faranell of the Royal Apothecary Society in the Undercity.
Report to Hadrec^16^All^Silverpine Forest^Apothecary Renferrel^High Executor Hadrec^Thule Ravenclaw^^^Report to High Executor Hadrec at the Sepulcher.^Before you launch an assault on Fenris Isle
column2: report to High Executor Hadrec. He may have additional information or equipment you'll need.

column1: The Deathstalkers' Report^11^All^Silverpine Forest^Rane Yorick^High Executor Hadrec^Escorting Erland^^^Bring the Deathstalker Report to High Executor Hadrec at the Sepulcher.^Although Quinn's wounds are mending
column2: I want to get our report to High Executor Hadrec as quickly as possible. It has information that is vital to the Forsaken's occupation of Silverpine.

column1: A Recipe For Death^15^All^Silverpine Forest^Master Apothecary Faranell^Apothecary Renferrel^A Recipe For Death^^^Retrieve Apothecary Berard's journal from Pyrewood Village and take it to Apothecary Renferrel at the Sepulcher.^You can be of further service to the Royal Apothecary Society
column2: <name>. When Arugal cast his wretched magic on the forest
column3: he cursed one of our most promising members
column4: Apothecary Berard. Now a mindless servant of Arugal
column5: Berard is useless to us. But his findings might prove to be of worth. He was studying an ancient plague that killed off all the aquatic life in Lake Lordamere ages ago. Retrieve Berard's Journal from his study in the Pyrewood Village Inn and take it to Apothecary Renferrel.

column1: A Recipe For Death^18^All^Silverpine Forest^Apothecary Renferrel^Master Apothecary Faranell^A Recipe For Death^^^Bring 6 samples of Lake Creeper Moss
column2: 6 samples of Lake Skulker Moss and a Hardened Tumor to Master Apothecary Faranell in the Undercity.^According to Berard's Journal the moss from Lake Skulkers and Creepers might prove useful for our quest to brew a new plague. Those beasts dwell on the islands in Lake Lordamere to the east. He also mentions a very rare Hardened Tumor that he discovered on a Vile Fin murloc. Apparently the tumor is so rare Berard was only able to obtain one. Collect samples of the moss as well as the rare hardened tumor and take them to Master Apothecary Faranell in the Undercity.

column1: Pyrewood Ambush^15^All^Silverpine Forest^Deathstalker Faerleia^Deathstalker Faerleia^^^^Help Deathstalker Faerleia kill the Pyrewood Council.^You got here just in the nick of time
column2: <name>! The Pyrewood Council will be returning any moment. Arugal has other matters to tend to in the keep. He uses the Council as mere puppets to keep the mindless minions of Pyrewood under his control. But I believe that without the guidance of the Pyrewood Council
column3: the sons of Arugal will turn against their master. I cannot handle them all by myself. I need you to help me. Together we can lay waste to the Council for Lady Sylvanas.

column1: Finding the Shadowy Figure^25^Alliance^Duskwood^Tavernkeep Smitts^Jitters^Sven's Revenge^^^Find the Shadowy Figure. Your clues:^Good luck
column2: <name>. I hope you find the chap
column3: and I hope you find him alive. If he's left the safety of Darkshire then he could be prey to the beasts of the wilds.

column1: After the Ambush^15^Alliance^Loch Modan^Huldar^Miran^Excavation Progress Report^^Protecting the Shipment^Speak with Miran.^We'd been hauling the barrels of powder back and forth in trips before this... business. Now we have to split up the work
column2: Miran's taking the barrels and I'm watching over the other ones. I don't feel safe letting Miran haul the rest of the shipment by himself. When he's ready to go
column3: maybe you could escort him on his next trip?

column1: The Algaz Gauntlet^21^Alliance^Wetlands^Mountaineer Rockgar^Valstag Ironjaw^Report to Mountaineer Rockgar^^^Traverse Dun Algaz.^Orcs of the Dragonmaw clan have a haven in the Wetlands. And now they have expanded into Dun Algaz! We can't let them keep their foothold here or Loch Modan will be cut off from Menethil Harbor
column2: our port and stronghold in the Wetlands. Break through Dun Algaz to the Wetlands beyond
column3: and kill some orcs for good measure! Report to Valstag Ironjaw in Menethil Harbor. Menethil is through Dun Algaz
column4: then north along the road
column5: then west at the fork. We're counting on you
column6: <name>. Do not fail.

column1: The Balance of Nature^2^All^Teldrassil^Conservator Ilthalaine^Conservator Ilthalaine^^^The Balance of Nature
column2: Simple Sigil
column3: Etched Sigil
column4: Encrypted Sigil
column5: Hallowed Sigil
column6: Verdant Sigil^Kill 4 Young Nightsabers and 4 Young Thistle Boars and return to Conservator Ilthalaine.^Greetings
column7: <name>. I am Conservator Ilthalaine. My purpose in Shadowglen is to ensure that the balance of nature is maintained. The spring rains were particularly heavy this year
column8: causing some of the forest's beasts to flourish while others suffered. Unfortunately
column9: the nightsaber and thistle boar populations grew too large. Shadowglen can only produce so much food for the beasts. Journey forth
column10: young <class>
column11: and thin the boar and saber populations so that nature's harmony will be preserved.

column1: The Balance of Nature^3^All^Teldrassil^Conservator Ilthalaine^Conservator Ilthalaine^^The Balance of Nature^^Conservator Ilthalaine needs you to kill 5 Mangy Nightsabers and 5 Thistle Boars.^Thinning the younger population of creatures here in Shadowglen was a good start
column2: <name>
column3: but there is still work to be done. The resources of the forest will be depleted too quickly if the problem is not addressed. Killing nature's beasts is a necessary evil for the good of all who share the land. Venture into the forest and slay mangy nightsabers and thistle boars in the name of balance.

column1: The Woodland Protector^1^All^Teldrassil^Melithar Staghelm^Tarindrella^The Woodland Protector^^^Seek out the dryad known as Tarindrella.^Thank goodness you are here
column2: <class>. Strange news has traveled to me through the whisperings of the forest spirits. The mysterious woodland protector
column3: Tarindrella
column4: has returned to Shadowglen. The dryad's presence has not been felt in the forests of Kalimdor in years. Something is surely amiss if she has journeyed back to this land. Seek out Tarindrella and see what business she tends to in our grove. One of the Sentinels reported seeing her to the southwest of Aldrassil.

column1: The Woodland Protector^3^All^Teldrassil^Tarindrella^Tarindrella^The Woodland Protector^^^Collect 8 Fel Moss and bring them to Tarindrella.^Something evil is brewing in the forests of Teldrassil. Look long the hills to where the peaceful furbolgs used to dwell. They have deserted their homes and are amassing under the name of the Gnarlpine tribe. Only the corruption of wicked Fel Moss could cause such a transformation. The grells and grellkin have infested the area and are threatening the residents of Shadowglen. Engage these grells and grellkin
column2: <name>
column3: and see if they are indeed caught under the enchantment of the wicked Fel Moss.

column1: Resting in Pieces^17^All^Silverpine Forest^A Talking Head^Shallow Grave^Resting in Pieces^^^Bring Alaric's Head to his grave.^You don't look like a rot hide. Good. I had lost hope... My name is Alaric
column2: and I was once Thule's head servant and bodyguard. He used his magic to "protect" me from the Plague of Undeath
column3: but instead his spell gave me an unlife from which I cannot escape. And after creating the cursed rot hide gnolls
column4: Thule beheaded me... and gave my head to the gnolls as a plaything! Please
column5: take me to my body. I believe the gnolls buried it here in Fenris Keep
column6: near the stable
column7: in an unmarked grave.

column1: The Hidden Niche^18^All^Silverpine Forest^Shallow Grave^Dusty Shelf^Resting in Pieces^^^Take Alaric to the hidden alcove.^I know of a hidden niche within the keep that holds an item dear to Thule
column2: and his old colleagues. It also holds something you might find useful. Take me there! The alcove is in the southwestern tower of the keep
column3: behind a dusty shelf. Take my body
column4: but leave my boots. They never fit me anyway...

column1: The Greenwarden^21^Alliance^Wetlands^First Mate Fitzsimmons^Rethiel the Greenwarden^The Greenwarden^^^Find the Greenwarden.^You've heard of the Greenwarden? You're not looking for him
column2: are you? Well I say you're crazy if you are
column3: but who am I to keep a fool from <his/her> death? If you are seeking that beast
column4: then I hear he is in the marsh
column5: east of the road where it forks to Dun Modr. He's lurking there among the crocs...and worse! And leave your money here. You won't need it where you're going...and you don't want to chip ol' Greenie's tooth on your gold when he bites you in half
column6: do you?

column1: War Banners^26^Alliance^Wetlands^Captain Stoutfist^Captain Stoutfist^Report to Captain Stoutfist^^^Bring 8 Dragonmaw War Banners to Captain Stoutfist.^The Dragonmaw orc clan was all but destroyed by the end of the Second War
column2: after they lost control of their red dragon pets. The dragons were not very happy with their old masters
column3: and fiercely hunted the Dragonmaws. What few remained fled from Grim Batol and into the Mountains east of Whelgar's Excavation. Now they've gained strength
column4: and have an encampment northeast of Menethil. We want you to attack that encampment. Gather and bring me their war banners as proof.

column1: Nek'rosh's Gambit^26^Alliance^Wetlands^Captain Stoutfist^Dragonmaw Catapult^Report to Captain Stoutfist^^^Destroy the Dragonmaw catapults.^While you were fighting the Dragonmaws
column2: we discovered more of their plans. Nek'rosh has built catapults and aims to lay siege to Menethil! And with the fighting in Dun Algaz
column3: we're effectively blocked from reinforcements! You need to take out those catapults. They're in the Dragonmaw encampment. Here
column4: take this tinder. Fight your way to the catapults and light them with the tinder. And after you've done that
column5: find and kill Nek'rosh. We need to cut this Dragonmaw beast down...at its neck.

column1: Search for Incendicite^22^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Pilot Stonegear^Pilot Stonegear^Stonegear's Search^^^Bring 6 loads of Incendicite Ore to Pilot Stonegear in Dun Morogh.^I heard that a rare ore
column2: incendicite
column3: was found in the Wetlands
column4: in a cave northwest of Algaz Gate. Incendicite is volatile stuff and hard to use without blowing yourself up
column5: but I'm sure if it's smelted the right way it could make cannon shells that pack a mighty punch! Get me incendicite ore and I'll find someone brave enough to experiment with it. Oh
column6: and to extract that ore from a vein you'll need skill in mining. If you don't have it
column7: then ... bring a friend who does to that cave!

column1: Stonegear's Search^23^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Mountaineer Kadrell^Pilot Stonegear^Stonegear's Search^^^Speak with Pilot Stonegear.^Pilot Stonegear loves his siege engine
column2: as every pilot should! And he's always eager to find new ways to improve his tank's firepower! He heard rumors of a rare ore and is looking for someone to hunt it down for him. If your boots are starting to itch
column3: then find Stonegear at Steelgrill's Depot in Dun Morogh and see what he wants.

column1: Report to Mountaineer Rockgar^21^Alliance^Wetlands^Mountaineer Kadrell^Mountaineer Rockgar^Report to Mountaineer Rockgar^^^Speak with Mountaineer Rockgar.^Mountaineer Rockgar is looking for volunteers for a mission through Dun Algaz and into the Wetlands. If you want to get your boots wet in that soggy county to the north
column2: then speak with Rockgar at Dun Algaz. Dun Algaz is north up the road
column3: beyond the guard tower.

column1: Daily Delivery^21^Alliance^Wetlands^Einar Stonegrip^James Halloran^^^^Deliver the Bundle of Crocolisk Skins to James Halloran
column2: the tanner
column3: in Menethil Harbor.^Greetings
column4: traveler! Don't suppose you might be heading in the direction of Menethil
column5: would you? If you're not
column6: I'd suggest you stop there
column7: it's a good place to purchase goods and even have a pint and relax. Now
column8: if it just so happens that you're heading in that direction
column9: I don't suppose you'd mind taking this bundle of crocolisk skins to James Halloran
column10: the tanner? I'd do it myself
column11: but my wife's been in quite a mood lately
column12: and I'd like to put off facing her as long as possible.

column1: Digging Through the Ooze^24^Alliance^Wetlands^Sida^Sida^^^^One of the oozes at Ironbeard's Tomb has Sida's bag
column2: retrieve it and bring it back to her in Menethil Harbor.^On my weekly visit to Ironbeard's Tomb I was attacked by dreadful
column3: dripping oozes! Naturally
column4: I panicked. I threw my bag at one
column5: but it didn't do anything! The ooze just sucked it right up... Luckily
column6: it did give me enough time to get away. The bad news is that I really need to get the contents of my bag! I don't know which ooze I threw my bag at; they all looked the same! Ironbeard's Tomb is northeast of here
column7: near Dun Modr. Thank you so much!

column1: Apprentice's Duties^26^Alliance^Wetlands^James Halloran^James Halloran^Young Crocolisk Skins^^^Collect 6 Giant Crocolisk Skins and bring them to James Halloran in Menethil Harbor.^I sent my apprentice out into the marshes to skin some of our famous giant Wetlands crocolisks. When he didn't return
column2: I went out to look for him... Let's just say it wasn't a pretty sight. Midwife says he might pull through
column3: but in the meantime I still need my skins! ...If you'd like to kill a few more of the brutes
column4: I wouldn't be opposed
column5: after what they did. You'll find the crocs north up the coast
column6: beyond the murloc hovels.

column1: Fall of Dun Modr^25^Alliance^Wetlands^Harlo Barnaby^Longbraid the Grim^^^^Search for Longbraid near the town of Dun Modr.^Dun Modr has fallen to the Dark Iron Dwarves! My wounds are grave
column2: <class>. Most of the regiment was killed! The Dark Iron thugs attacked us before we could regroup from the Thandol Span ambush. Our leader
column3: Longbraid
column4: sounded the retreat horn. As we left the town I was hit by a stray axe in the back. All went black. I awoke here in Menethil but I fear for my fellow soldiers. Hope still burns within me. Perhaps Longbraid is still alive! See if you can find him near Dun Modr
column5: <race>!

column1: Report to Captain Stoutfist^26^Alliance^Wetlands^Valstag Ironjaw^Captain Stoutfist^Report to Captain Stoutfist^^^Speak with Captain Stoutfist.^<name>. The Dragonmaw orc clan is showing its strength in more than just Algaz. Captain Stoutfist has asked to speak with those willing to offer aid against these orcs. He is inside the keep
column2: in the war room.

column1: Defeat Nek'rosh^26^Alliance^Wetlands^Dragonmaw Catapult^Captain Stoutfist^Report to Captain Stoutfist^^^Kill Chieftain Nek'rosh^Now that the catapults have been burned
column2: find and kill Chieftain Nek'rosh.

column1: A Troubling Breeze^6^Alliance^Teldrassil^Athridas Bearmantle^Gaerolas Talvethren^A Troubling Breeze^^^Seek out Gaerolas Talvethren in Starbreeze Village.^A troubling breeze blows through the forest. Gaerolas Talvethren serves as Great Warden to the hibernating Druids of the Talon in the Ban'ethil Barrow Den. His duty as the chosen protector of the Sleeping is to ensure their safety so that their pact with Ysera remains fulfilled. But word from Gaerolas is now delayed and I grow nervous. Travel east to Starbreeze Village and bring back a report from Gaerolas so that I can put my worries to rest
column2: knowing my dreaming brethren slumber safely.

column1: Gnarlpine Corruption^6^All^Teldrassil^Gaerolas Talvethren^Athridas Bearmantle^A Troubling Breeze^^^Return to Athridas Bearmantle in Dolanaar.^The Gnarlpine tribe has been corrupted! The once peaceful furbolgs have turned against the protectors of the forest. They ambushed me as I left for the Ban'ethil Barrow Den and proceeded to pillage Starbreeze Village. Ursal the Mauler
column2: their chieftain
column3: is using the evil powers of the Fel Moss to drive them mad. I am too wounded to return to Athridas to bring him this grave news. The task is left to you
column4: young <class>. We can only hope that the deranged Gnarlpines have not made it to Ban'ethil yet!

column1: Border Crossings^14^All^Silverpine Forest^Shadow Priest Allister^Dalaran Crate^Border Crossings^^^Retrieve the contents of one of the Dalaran wizards' crates. You will find Pyrewood Village to the south.^As you may know
column2: the town of Ambermill remains a source of human opposition
column3: mainly through the support they receive from the wizards of Dalaran. I don't know what their plan is
column4: but for them to show interest in a backwater village like Ambermill indicates that it must have some greater importance. They've been shipping crates by the wagon from Hillsbrad. Many of those supplies end up at a small camp north of Pyrewood Village. Retrieve the contents of a crate and return them to me.

column1: Maps and Runes^14^All^Silverpine Forest^Dalaran Crate^Shadow Priest Allister^Border Crossings^^^Bring the strange pendant to Shadow Priest Allister at the Sepulcher.^<You quickly remove the pendant from the crate and replace the lid.>

Ambermill Investigations^16^All^Silverpine Forest^Shadow Priest Allister^Shadow Priest Allister^Border Crossings^^^Obtain 8 Dalaran Pendants for Shadow Priest Allister at the Sepulcher.^Dalar is attempting to locate the source of the wizards' spellcasting. For now
column2: we'll have to slow their progress in any way we can... The conjurers
column3: mages and protectors are no doubt carrying the pendants. Remove and retrieve them. Take the main road south and the eastern fork into Ambermill.

column1: The Weaver^22^All^Silverpine Forest^Shadow Priest Allister^Shadow Priest Allister^Border Crossings^^^Kill the Dalaran archmage
column2: then retrieve his staff for Shadow Priest Allister at the Sepulcher.^An archmage of great power is overseeing the reactivation of the ley energy node. With the progress they have made
column3: our only hope of stopping them is by killing him. It will be difficult
column4: he is no doubt protected by many other mages and warders. You must go
column5: and you must dispatch him quickly. When he is dead
column6: retrieve his staff for me. Go now.

column1: Dalar's Analysis^14^All^Silverpine Forest^Shadow Priest Allister^Dalar Dawnweaver^Border Crossings^^^Take the rune-inscribed pendant to Dalar Dawnweaver at the Sepulcher.^Take the pendant to Dalar Dawnweaver
column2: perhaps he can shed some light on the wizards' plans.

column1: Dalaran's Intentions^14^All^Silverpine Forest^Dalar Dawnweaver^Shadow Priest Allister^Border Crossings^^^Speak with Shadow Priest Allister at the Sepulcher.^Of course! How could I have forgotten? Ambermill was one of the sites earmarked by the Kirin Tor
column2: noted because it houses a dormant ley energy node. The wizards must be planning to reactivate the node and use its energies for some greater purpose. We cannot allow this to happen... It will take a great amount of power to activate the area's ley energies
column3: we can stall them by taking the pendants away from the wizards. Relay this information to Allister
column4: he will decide a course of action.

column1: The Relics of Wakening^9^All^Teldrassil^Athridas Bearmantle^Athridas Bearmantle^A Troubling Breeze^^^Retrieve the Relics of Wakening and bring them to Athridas Bearmantle in Dolanaar.^Gnarlpine invaders were seen ravaging the Ban'ethil Barrow Den to the west. The slumbering druids will be trapped in the Emerald Dream for eternity
column2: unaware of their fate
column3: unless we help. The delicate hibernation ritual cannot be broken without the Relics of Wakening. Journey to the Den and retrieve the Raven Claw Talisman
column4: Black Feather Quill
column5: Sapphire of Sky
column6: and Rune of Nesting. The druids store them in sacred chests. Return them to me and I will prepare the awakening ritual.

column1: Young Crocolisk Skins^22^Alliance^Wetlands^James Halloran^James Halloran^Young Crocolisk Skins^^^Obtain 4 Young Crocolisk Skins for James Halloran in Menethil Harbor.^I'm James Halloran
column2: the tanner. My cured crocolisk skins are sought after all over
column3: shipments leaving by boat to ports around the world. Met Einar? He's one of the hunters that brings crocolisk skins in for me. I'm a bit short on the softer skins that come off crocolisk young. Being that I'm running low
column4: I'll pay you top coin for a stack of the skins. You can find the young crocs in the marshes right outside of town.

column1: Find OOX-09/HL!^48^All^The Hinterlands^OOX-09/HL Distress Beacon^Homing Robot OOX-09/HL^Find OOX-09/HL!^^^Take the distress beacon to Oglethorpe's homing robot at the head of the river in the Hinterlands
column2: near Skulk Rock.^You have uncovered some sort of strange
column3: egg-shaped device made from metal. Fiddling with one of its knobs springs the egg to life
column4: as it opens up into some sort of gnomish robotic contraption! A voice from inside the robotic egg crackles to life. "My name's Oglethorpe Obnoticus
column5: and my homing robot has crashed! I will reward you for its recovery; please take this beacon to the robot!" "I now have computed the coordinates of the robot for you; it crashed at the head of the river near Skulk Rock!"

column1: Ursal the Mauler^12^All^Teldrassil^Athridas Bearmantle^Athridas Bearmantle^A Troubling Breeze^^^Kill Ursal the Mauler and return to Athridas Bearmantle in Dolanaar.^Now the time has come to save the Druids of the Talon. If we fail now
column2: <name>
column3: they will be forever lost in sleep. I shall prepare the Relics of Wakening and perform the ritual. For my work to take effect
column4: the cursed beast responsible for this horrible situation must be slain. Only then will the ritual be complete. It was Ursal the Mauler who meddled with our brethren's calling and it is Ursal the Mauler who must now pay so they can be freed. Travel to Gnarlpine Hold in the southwest and slay him.

column1: The Road to Darnassus^8^All^Teldrassil^Moon Priestess Amara^Moon Priestess Amara^^^^Slay 6 Gnarlpine Ambushers and return to Sentinel Amara Nightwalker outside of Dolanaar.^The road to Darnassus must be kept safe. Travelers heading from Dolanaar to Darnassus have been reporting ruthless attacks by corrupted furbolgs from the Gnarlpine tribe. Important news and commerce travels to and from Darnassus by way of this road daily. We cannot afford to have a rogue band of heathens terrorizing people. Take up arms in the name of the sacred forest
column2: <class>. Their den lies somewhere below this vantage point. Slay 6 of these Gnarlpine ambushers and report back to me.

column1: Zenn's Bidding^5^All^Teldrassil^Zenn Foulhoof^Zenn Foulhoof^^^Seek Redemption!^Bring Zenn Foulhoof outside of Dolanaar 3 Nightsaber Fangs
column2: 3 Strigid Owl Feathers and 3 swatches of Webwood Spider Silk.^Eager for work
column3: I see. Lucky for you a day never goes by that I don't wish I had a fledgling <class> to perform my bidding. You see
column4: <name>
column5: I can make you very happy and provide you with things you never dreamed of having. But in order for that to happen you must bring me certain items. My business in the forest often requires certain. . .reagents. Fetch for me 3 Nightsaber Fangs
column6: 3 Strigid Owl Feathers and 3 swatches of Webwood Spider Silk. Let's keep this our little secret
column7: <race>.

column1: Seek Redemption!^7^All^Teldrassil^Sentinel Kyra Starsong^Zenn Foulhoof^^Zenn's Bidding^^Collect 3 Fel Cones and give them to Zenn Foulhoof outside of Dolanaar.^The Council of the Forest has news that you aided Zenn Foulhoof. The satyr is an enemy of the forest. As a <race>
column2: you should know better than to defile the forest by killing Nature's creatures. You must redeem yourself in the eyes of the Council if you wish to remain a friend of Teldrassil. Teach Foulhoof a lesson and you shall be redeemed. Fel Cones are corrupted seeds that fall from the trees. They billow with green smoke. Give some to Foulhoof. He'll think you have brought him a harmless snack.

column1: Wand to Bethor^18^All^Silverpine Forest^Dusty Shelf^Bethor Iceshard^Resting in Pieces^^^Take the Woven Wand to Bethor Iceshard in the Magic Quarter of the Undercity.^Thule once told me that
column2: long ago
column3: he and two colleagues created a magic wand
column4: woven together from the apprentice wands each mage possessed. This wand was a symbol of their friendship
column5: and although Thule came to despise it he could not part with it
column6: nor could he let the others have it. So he stole the wand
column7: and hid it in Fenris Keep. Here. Take the wand to Bethor Iceshard
column8: one of Thule's friends from years past. I'm sure he will want it.

column1: A New Plague^11^All^Tirisfal Glades^Apothecary Johaan^Captured Mountaineer^A New Plague^^^Bring Johaan's Special Drink to the Captured Mountaineer.^According to the Deathguard
column2: another one of those foolish Dwarven Mountaineers has just been captured. The Deathguard likes to use the cellar of the Gallows End Tavern as a holding cell until prisoners can be "properly" dealt with. Why don't you go see how the Captured Mountaineer enjoys this special drink I made for him? It contains a subtle hint of what The Dark Lady has planned for the rest of Azeroth.

column1: Journey to Hillsbrad Foothills^20^All^Silverpine Forest^Apothecary Renferrel^Apothecary Lydon^^^^Deliver Apothecary Renferrel's findings to Apothecary Lydon in the town of Tarren Mill in the Hillsbrad Foothills.^The Royal Apothecary Society is under extreme pressure from the Dark Lady to develop a New Plague. We are working diligently and have made much progress. It is our belief that the success will be achieved much faster if we share information amongst the Society. For that reason I want you to deliver my latest findings to Apothecary Lydon in Tarren Mill
column2: a small town nestled in the Hillsbrad Foothills. The journey will be a long one. Head south and stick to the roads. Follow the signs closely!

column1: Time To Strike^20^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Deathstalker Lesh^High Executor Darthalia^^^^Travel to Tarren Mill to deliver Deathstalker Lesh's message to High Executor Darthalia.^Be silent and pay attention
column2: <class>. I was sent to this position in order to survey the town of Hillsbrad. My mission is one of reconnaissance. It is imperative that you send word to High Executor Darthalia in Tarren Mill at once. Let her know that I
column3: Deathstalker Lesh
column4: send the following message: "The raven's cry from the west doth beckon." Follow the road to the east and pay close attention to the signs. Now
column5: hurry! Off you go to Tarren Mill
column6: and with urgency I might add!

column1: The Crown of Will^39^Horde^Undercity^Sharlindra^Melisara^The Crown of Will^^^Report to Melisara at Tarren Mill in the Hillsbrad Foothills.^Mug'Thol and his ogre warband was sent to Alterac to retrieve the Crown of Will for Lady Sylvanas. Unfortunately
column2: instead of returning it
column3: the idiot decided to try it on... I suppose ogres can't resist anything bright and shiny. His bumbling actions have become something of a problem
column4: however. The Crown of Will enabled him to resist the possession placed upon him to serve Lady Sylvanas. The Dark Lady wants an example made
column5: travel to Tarren Mill in Hillsbrad and report to Melisara
column6: my lieutenant.

column1: Elixir of Suffering^22^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Apothecary Lydon^Apothecary Lydon^Elixir of Suffering^^^Apothecary Lydon of Tarren Mill wants 10 Gray Bear Tongues and some Creeper Ichor.^Ah
column2: another wretched day in Tarren Mill. All of this clean air puts me in such a foul mood
column3: <name>. The sooner we can plague the humans here
column4: the better. I've been conducting intense studies on possible killing agents to use in my concoctions but I haven't the time to collect them all. If you want to make yourself of use
column5: procure the following items for me: 10 Gray Bear Tongues and the very rare and hard to find
column6: Creeper Ichor. You'll find both bears and creepers just outside of Tarren Mill.

column1: The Rescue^22^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Krusk^Krusk^^^^Krusk in Tarren Mill needs you to free Drull and Tog'thar from Durnholde Keep.^Me and some other warriors were sent by the Warchief to retrieve an object from Durnholde and to investigate this so-called Syndicate. We went to Durnholde to take a look around
column2: but we were taken by surprise by a large number of the humans. We fought bravely
column3: but their sheer numbers were enough to defeat us. They took a few of us captive
column4: but I was able to escape. Durnholde is just southeast of here
column5: across the river. Drull and Tog'thar are being held there
column6: you must go and rescue them.

column1: Elixir of Suffering^22^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Apothecary Lydon^Umpi^Elixir of Suffering^^Elixir of Pain^Give Umpi the Elixir of Suffering.^It will take but a moment for me to mix these components into what I have deemed an Elixir of Suffering. There we go! Ah
column2: nothing brightens a gloomy day in these miserable foothills like bringing a little suffering into the world. Let us see if our little potion has achieved its desired effect. Give my assistant Umpi a taste of what the Dark Lady has planned for both humans and Scourge alike.

column1: Crushridge Bounty^36^Alliance^Alterac Mountains^Marshal Redpath^Marshal Redpath^Crushridge Bounty^^^Gather 9 Dirty Knucklebones from Crushridge ogres in the Alterac Mountains. Bring them to Marshal Redpath in Southshore.^Crushridge ogres have dug an ogre mound up in the Alterac Mountains near the ruined city of Alterac. And my scouts tell me they've taken over those ruins as well. We can't let them get cozy up there; if they think they're safe where they are
column2: then their next step will be to move down into the foothills
column3: which will put them right at our front door! Go north to the Alterac Mountains and hunt ogres. Bring me the Dirty Knucklebones they carry and you will earn a nice bounty.

column1: Elixir of Pain^24^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Apothecary Lydon^Apothecary Lydon^Elixir of Pain^Elixir of Suffering^^Bring 10 vials of Mountain Lion Blood to Apothecary Lydon in Tarren Mill.^Oh
column2: <name>. . .the flowers are blooming in Hillsbrad and the air is so fresh and brisk. I can't help but to wallow in the misery of it all. I look out my grimy window and long for the day when our New Plague brings this world the death it deserves. As much as I would love to sit and brood all day
column3: my duty to the Dark Lady calls. Help me
column4: would you? My research leads me to believe I can make the most splendid death-brew with the blood of a Mountain Lion. Bring some to me and we'll have a little fun.

column1: Elixir of Pain^24^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Apothecary Lydon^Stanley^Elixir of Pain^^Elixir of Agony^Feed the Elixir of Pain to Stanley.^Ah
column2: nothing like the smell of fresh blood in the foothills! Now we'll mix in a touch of this and a little of that and let the real fun begin! What I have created with this blood
column3: I like to call an Elixir of Pain. If my calculations are correct this concoction could be the start of something very beautiful for Lady Sylvanas. But what we need is a test. Take this elixir out to the northern farm in Hillsbrad Fields to the southwest. Let's see how Farmer Ray's little dog Stanley likes this "treat."

column1: Gol'dir^36^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Krusk^Gol'dir^Infiltration^^^Free Gol'dir then return to Krusk in Tarren Mill.^From what I can tell of the documents you procured
column2: Gol'dir is being held in a large Syndicate base to the north
column3: most likely in the Alterac Mountains. He has been held captive far too long and must be freed.

column1: Crushridge Warmongers^40^Alliance^Alterac Mountains^Marshal Redpath^Marshal Redpath^Crushridge Bounty^^^Slay 10 Crushridge Warmongers
column2: then return to Marshal Redpath in Southshore.^Now that you've had a taste of the Crushridge ogres
column3: I want you to really bloody their noses... Go into the Ruins of Alterac and seek out the Crushridge Warmongers. I want you to cut down a good number of them - that's the only way those brutes will learn to keep their distance from Alliance territory.

column1: Syndicate Assassins^33^Alliance^Alterac Mountains^Magistrate Henry Maleb^Magistrate Henry Maleb^^^^Kill 12 Syndicate Footpads and 8 Syndicate Thieves
column2: then return to Magistrate Henry Maleb in Southshore.^I am the new magistrate of Southshore
column3: recently assigned after the assassination of the previous magistrate. The assassins were never found
column4: but through our investigations we're almost certain they were hired by the Syndicate - a group of thieves led by villainous nobles of the now fallen kingdom of Alterac. The Syndicate has a camps in Sofera's Naze and Corahn's Dagger
column5: north and west of the Horde-occupied Tarren Mill. Slay the Syndicate members you find in these camps.

column1: Blackmoore's Legacy^36^All^Hillsbrad Foothills^Gol'dir^Krusk^Infiltration^^^Return the information gathered by Gol'dir to Krusk in Tarren Mill.^A day or two ago
column2: I was visited by the leader of this Syndicate. His name was Aliden Perenolde
column3: and styled himself lord of this land. He confided in me his plans to take the orcs that stood against him as slaves
column4: just as his father and his mentor
column5: the despised Blackmoore
column6: had planned. More important was that he brought his mistress
column7: a wisp of a girl named Elysa. Around her neck was the pendant the Warchief desires. Now go
column8: I will make my own way
column9: after I have settled my business here.

column1: Lord Aliden Perenolde^42^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Krusk^Elysa^Infiltration^^^Kill Lord Aliden Perenolde and ask his mistress
column2: Elysa
column3: about Taretha's pendant.^It is clear that Perenolde must be killed
column4: his foulness removed from the world. His manor lies a ways to the north of here
column5: on the shores of Lordamere Lake. Do your duty
column6: <name>
column7: then retrieve the pendant that the Warchief desires
column8: and return here.

column1: Taretha's Gift^40^All^Hillsbrad Foothills^Elysa^Krusk^Infiltration^^^Return Taretha's pendant to Krusk at Tarren Mill in Hillsbrad Foothills.^The pendant? Of course you can have it... Take it! I want no memory of him... just please
column2: please leave in peace...

column1: Elixir of Agony^28^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Apothecary Lydon^Apothecary Lydon^Elixir of Agony^Elixir of Pain^^Bring 6 Mudsnout Blossoms to Apothecary Lydon in Tarren Mill.^Another day
column2: another elixir to be made. If it were up to me
column3: I'd just let the pathetic humans and Scourge fight it out. They seem bent on killing each other as is. Alas
column4: our Dark Lady wants to help speed up the process a tad so why not pass these morbid days by spreading a little death and disease across the land? Here's the plan
column5: <name>: you go out to Nethander Stead
column6: south of Tarren Mill and east of the river and Southshore. Collect for me 6 Mudsnout Blossoms from the field for my next elixir.

column1: Foreboding Plans^34^Alliance^Alterac Mountains^Syndicate Documents^Magistrate Henry Maleb^Foreboding Plans^^^Bring the Foreboding Plans to Magistrate Maleb in Southshore.^Among these documents is a list of requested supplies. These include mundane items (food
column2: weapons
column3: clothing) as well as more exotic gear (masks
column4: oil
column5: poison). But what is most notable is the urgency of the request - these supplies were needed soon in order to undertake what is described in the document as an "important mission against Southshore."

column1: Encrypted Letter^34^Alliance^Alterac Mountains^Syndicate Documents^Loremaster Dibbs^Encrypted Letter^^^Bring the Encrypted Letter to Loremaster Dibbs in Southshore.^One of the letters on this table is encrypted and inscrutable.

Noble Deaths^36^Alliance^Alterac Mountains^Magistrate Henry Maleb^Magistrate Henry Maleb^Foreboding Plans^^^Bring 7 Alterac Signet Rings to Magistrate Maleb in Southshore.^I fear the leadership behind the Syndicate is bent on Southshore's ruin. We must strike hard at these leaders before their plans are realized. Enter the ruins of Strahnbrad
column2: in the Alterac Mountains to the north. We think the Syndicate is using the area as a headquarters. We know this gang of cutthroats is run by former Alterac nobles. They may be hiding as normal Syndicate agents
column3: but you'll know you've killed a noble by the signet ring he wears. Bring me those signet rings.

column1: Elixir of Agony^28^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Apothecary Lydon^Master Apothecary Faranell^Elixir of Agony^^^Take the Mudsnout Composite to Master Apothecary Faranell in the Undercity.^Just when I thought another day was going to pass devoid of any joy
column2: you brought me those marvelous Mudsnout Blossoms. First I will mix them down into a fine composite. We'll then need Master Apothecary Faranell in the Undercity to apply his colloid of decay to it and then we'll be ready for some good fun indeed! Here
column3: take this Mudsnout Composite and run it off to Master Faranell at once
column4: <name>.

column1: Letter to Stormpike^34^Alliance^Alterac Mountains^Loremaster Dibbs^Prospector Stormpike^Encrypted Letter^^^Take the Cleverly Encrypted Letter to Prospector Stormpike in Ironforge.^I have a colleague in Ironforge who may be able to help decrypt this letter. Go to the Library in the Hall of Explorers in Ironforge and speak with Prospector Stormpike. Tell him I sent you and show him the letter. If there's anyone north of Blackrock Spire who can read this
column2: it is he.

column1: Elixir of Agony^30^All^Hillsbrad Foothills^Master Apothecary Faranell^Apothecary Lydon^Elixir of Agony^^^Bring the Mudsnout Mixture
column2: a Strong Troll's Blood Potion
column3: 5 Daggerspine Scales and 5 Torn Fin Eyes to Apothecary Lydon in Tarren Mill.^A mudsnout composite? Absolutely brilliant! Why didn't I think of that? Let me contribute my colloid of decay to this devilish brew. In order to activate the contaminating agents in this mudsnout mixture
column4: Lydon is going to need a strong troll's blood potion
column5: as well as some daggerspine scales and torn fin eyes from the southern coast of Hillsbrad. He'll know what to do once you've gathered him all the reagents. And my
column6: how anxious I am to hear how his experiment goes!

column1: Beren's Peril^21^All^Silverpine Forest^Shadow Priest Allister^Shadow Priest Allister^^^^Locate Beren's Peril
column2: then kill 6 Ravenclaw Drudgers and 6 Ravenclaw Guardians
column3: then return to Shadow Priest Allister at the Sepulcher.^I have received reports that a group of undead are holing up to prepare for an attack against us. Armed with this information
column4: we can turn the tables and attack them first
column5: nipping their little plan in the bud. Unfortunately
column6: my information is spotty
column7: at best. They are reported to be hiding in a location known as Beren's Peril. The exact location is unknown
column8: but it appears to be a cave in the hills
column9: near a pocket of Dalaran wizards. I trust your resourcefulness. Find them
column10: and put them down.

column1: Elixir of Agony^30^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Apothecary Lydon^Apothecary Lydon^Elixir of Agony^^^Bring a keg of Shindigger Stout to Apothecary Lydon in Tarren Mill.^This new elixir is finally ready to be tested. But why let a perfectly good
column2: highly contagious plague go to waste on a mere frog or dog? Let's have us some true fun in the name of Lady Sylvanas. Head down to Dun Garok. You know the barracks where those filthy little dwarves skitter about. Steal me a keg of their Shindigger Stout. Once I have that keg
column3: you and I will have quite the party
column4: <name>.

column1: The Crown of Will^39^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Melisara^Melisara^The Crown of Will^^^Kill 10 Crushridge Maulers for Melisara in Tarren Mill.^Mug'Thol and his Crushridge ogres have overrun the ruins of Alterac. It will be hard to inflict any serious punishment upon him without thinning out the ogres' numbers. After softening them up
column2: we'll proceed. Understood? Good. Now go.

column1: The Crown of Will^41^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Melisara^Melisara^The Crown of Will^^^Kill Targ
column2: Muckrake
column3: and Glommus and bring their heads to Melisara in Tarren Mill.^Targ
column4: Muckrake
column5: and Glommus are Mug'Thol's lieutenants. They are loyal to him
column6: though who can say what drives an ogre to loyalty. Bring me their heads
column7: <name>
column8: and then all that will remain is to remove Mug'Thol's head
column9: crown and all.

column1: The Crown of Will^43^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Melisara^Melisara^The Crown of Will^^^Kill Mug'Thol
column2: and return his head with the Crown of Will to Melisara in Tarren Mill.^With Mug'Thol's lieutenants dead
column3: all that remains is to kill Mug'Thol and retrieve the Crown of Will. I have no doubt he'll be reluctant to part with it. Most likely expecting you
column4: too
column5: given the... departure... of his fellows. Find Mug'Thol
column6: and deliver his head and the Crown to me. The Crushridge resistance will be at an end.

column1: The Crown of Will^43^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Melisara^Sharlindra^The Crown of Will^^^Deliver the Crown of Will to Sharlindra in the Undercity.^All that remains is to deliver the Crown of Will to Sharlindra in the Undercity. She will see that it is delivered to Lady Sylvanas. I would warn you against thinking to use it for your own purposes
column2: <name>
column3: Mug'Thol's fate should be illustration enough.

column1: Assassin's Contract^38^Alliance^Alterac Mountains^Assassin's Contract^Magistrate Henry Maleb^Assassin's Contract^^^Bring the Assassin's Contract to Magistrate Maleb in Southshore.^This is a contract for the assassination of Magistrate Henry Maleb. It was sealed and stamped in red wax
column2: using a distinctive signet ring.

column1: Baron's Demise^40^Alliance^Alterac Mountains^Magistrate Henry Maleb^Magistrate Henry Maleb^Assassin's Contract^^^Bring the Head of Baron Vardus to Magistrate Maleb in Southshore.^The contract you recovered was signed by Baron Vardus
column2: a noble of the former kingdom of Alterac
column3: and one known for a cold heart and brutal practices. I'm not surprised someone like the Baron was behind this. Find this man. Find him
column4: and bring him to justice. He must be among the Syndicate haunts - perhaps at the ruins of Strahnbrad
column5: or perhaps within the valley north of them.

column1: Elixir of Agony^30^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Apothecary Lydon^Dusty Rug^Elixir of Agony^^^Place the Tainted Keg on the rug for the captured farmers.^Next door the Deathguards are holding a few captured farmers hostage. High Executor Darthalia suspected one of the military strategists from Stormwind to be hiding out amongst them. Apparently the military chap was found dead in the Plaguelands last night. Darthalia
column2: always looking out for me
column3: decided the prisoners would be left to my disposal. I think it's time we threw those farmers a party. Sounds like a grand ol' time! Place this tainted keg on the rug in their room. Plagued brew for all!

column1: Further Mysteries^34^Alliance^Alterac Mountains^Prospector Stormpike^Magistrate Henry Maleb^Encrypted Letter^^^Bring the Decrypted Letter to Magistrate Maleb in Southshore.^I decrypted the letter
column2: but I don't know what to make of it. You found this among thieves in the Alterac foothills? Very strange... You should take this to the magistrate of Southshore. Although this letter is cryptic
column3: his is the closest town to Alterac; if a threat is brewing
column4: then he should know.

column1: Lightforge Ingots^29^Alliance^Duskwood^Glorin Steelbrow^Glorin Steelbrow^Lightforge Ingots^The Lost Ingots^^Gather 5 lightforge ingots
column2: then return to Glorin Steelbrow in the Wetlands.^You might have found one lightforge ingot in that chest
column3: but that's not enough to craft anything decent! You should go back there and look for more. Maybe the murlocs around that wrecked ship have lightforge ingots on them.

column1: Battle of Hillsbrad^24^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^High Executor Darthalia^High Executor Darthalia^Battle of Hillsbrad^^^Kill 6 Hillsbrad Farmhands
column2: 6 Hillsbrad Farmers
column3: Farmer Ray and Farmer Getz and report back to Darthalia in Tarren Mill.^Stand at attention while addressing me
column4: <class>. I am under direct command of Varimathras. We are to quell the human infestation until our apothecaries can develop the new plague. Our information leads us to believe that the town of Hillsbrad is vulnerable to attack. Your first assignment is aimed at disrupting their food supply and infrastructure. Travel west. Raid the northernmost farms of Hillsbrad Fields. Make sure that the landowners
column5: Farmer Ray and Farmer Getz
column6: are executed as well.

column1: Battle of Hillsbrad^25^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^High Executor Darthalia^High Executor Darthalia^Battle of Hillsbrad^^^Kill 15 Hillsbrad Peasants and report back to Darthalia in Tarren Mill.^Word of the attack on the northern farms has the townsfolk panicked. Most excellent. Our Deathstalkers report peasants fleeing to the fields in southern Hillsbrad. The fools think they can hide in the orchards and escape their doom. Prove them wrong
column2: <name>. Return to Hillsbrad Fields and seek out the cowering peasants. Lay waste to them in the name of our Dark Lady. Dismissed!

column1: Battle of Hillsbrad^26^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^High Executor Darthalia^High Executor Darthalia^Battle of Hillsbrad^^^Kill Blacksmith Verringtan and 4 Hillsbrad Apprentice Blacksmiths.^The humans of Hillsbrad have been putting up unexpected resistance. The problem appears to be that the townsfolk are being armed by the local blacksmith. We need to shut down all supply lines. Your mission will be to execute Blacksmith Verringtan. Slay his apprentices as well. While there
column2: bring back a shipment of iron from their stockpile. The supplies will come in handy when we are done with the conquering of Hillsbrad and begin razing Southshore.

column1: A Husband's Revenge^20^All^Silverpine Forest^Raleigh Andrean^Raleigh Andrean^The Engraved Ring^^^Kill Valdred Moray.^Valdred
column2: once my good friend
column3: was my wife's murderer. Although I am incapable of grieving
column4: I do yearn for revenge. If you kill Valdred and bring me his cursed hands
column5: then I will reward you. I last heard he was at the Greymane Wall in southern Silverpine
column6: trying to flee into the kingdom of Gilneas.

column1: Vyrin's Revenge^20^Alliance^Loch Modan^Daryl the Youngling^Vyrin Swiftwind^Vyrin's Revenge^^^Bring Ol' Sooty's head to Vyrin Swiftwind at the Farstrider Lodge.^Light! Don't bring things like that into the Lodge... it's unsanitary
column2: unspeakable
column3: un... un... unsanitary! Just get it out of here
column4: will you? No one wants to see your bloody little trophy
column5: really!

column1: Battle of Hillsbrad^26^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^High Executor Darthalia^High Executor Darthalia^Battle of Hillsbrad^^^Kill Magistrate Burnside and 4 Hillsbrad Councilmen. Destroy the Hillsbrad Proclamation. Steal the Hillsbrad Town Registry. Report back to Darthalia in Tarren Mill afterwards.^The town of Hillsbrad is in disarray and we believe it will soon fall. We must
column2: however
column3: persist in our ruthlessness until the human scum are wiped from the foothills for eternity. Despite their overwhelming losses
column4: the humans rally around their leadership and keep fighting. We must eliminate their leader
column5: Magistrate Burnside
column6: as well as the town council. Destroy their revered political document as well
column7: the Hillsbrad Proclamation. And while you're at it
column8: steal the town registry.

column1: Infiltration^34^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Krusk^Krusk^Infiltration^^^Retrieve information about Gol'dir's whereabouts for Krusk in Tarren Mill.^At last we begin to hear word and rumor
column2: find evidence of Gol'dir's whereabouts. The humans have been moving him around
column3: but we are narrowing down our search and focusing on the large Syndicate camp just north of here. Go there
column4: <name>
column5: and bring back whatever information you can get your hands on.

column1: Valik^34^All^Alterac Mountains^Henchman Valik^Henchman Valik^^^^Bring a mug of Southshore Stout to Valik in the Syndicate camp.^Urrgh... Injured and dying and confronted with the enemy. No doubt you'll kill me anyway
column2: but if you bring me some Southshore stout--your kind does drink
column3: don't they?--I'll tell you what you want to know.

column1: Down the Coast^30^Alliance^Hillsbrad Foothills^Lieutenant Farren Orinelle^Lieutenant Farren Orinelle^Down the Coast^^^Kill 10 Torn Fin Tidehunters and 10 Torn Fin Oracles for Lieutenant Farren Orinelle in Southshore.^Transferred from the Stormwind city guard to Southshore
column2: a town that should be abandoned by the looks of it... Smell of the harbor day and night. Not to mention ol' Redpath... Wants me to take care of the murlocs. Ha! I can barely rouse myself to go out to some of the pockets of the overgrown fish down the Western Strand. If you would go in my place and take care of them
column3: I'd appreciate it.

column1: Dark Council^40^Alliance^Alterac Mountains^Magistrate Henry Maleb^Magistrate Henry Maleb^Encrypted Letter^^^Kill 4 Argus Shadow Mages.^The letter you brought me was written by a being who calls himself Nagaz
column2: a member of the Argus Wake. I don't know what this Argus Wake is
column3: but if they're in alliance with the Syndicate then they must be a threat. I want you to find Nagaz and the Argus Shadow Mages mentioned in that letter. I want you to find them
column4: and kill them. Search in the Uplands
column5: where the Syndicate is strongest. It is north of Strahnbrad. With luck
column6: you'll find these envoys of the Argus Wake there.

column1: Southshore^38^Alliance^Stormwind City^Milton Sheaf^Loremaster Dibbs^An Old History Book^^^Speak with Loremaster Dibbs in Southshore.^<name>. If you don't mind a long journey then I have a task for you
column2: to again help Stormwind fill its library. The old kingdom of Alterac fell after the great war
column3: and it had a large collection of books. It's a tragedy that the city is ruined
column4: but even more tragic is all of their knowledge lost! We must recover what we can. Southshore is the closest town to the Ruins of Alterac. Go there and speak with Loremaster Dibbs. He can direct you to the ruins
column5: and to what books may be found there.

column1: Battle of Hillsbrad^28^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^High Executor Darthalia^High Executor Darthalia^Battle of Hillsbrad^^^Kill Foreman Bonds and 10 Hillsbrad Miners and report back to Darthalia in Tarren Mill.^The Hillsbrad Town Registry indicates that the Azurelode Mine is under Alliance control. Furthermore
column2: the mine is a prime source of iron ore for the Alliance armories. Even though we've struck a decisive blow to the town of Hillsbrad
column3: the Alliance still supports and protects the Azurelode Mine fervently. The mine lies due south of Hillsbrad. Go there and slay the foreman
column4: a human by the name of Bonds. Kill his miners as well. That should send a clear message to the Alliance.

column1: Preserving Knowledge^38^Alliance^Stormwind City^Loremaster Dibbs^Loremaster Dibbs^An Old History Book^^^Bring 5 Recovered Tomes and the Worn Leather Book containing The Arm of Gri'lek to Loremaster Dibbs in Southshore.^Those beastly ogres now reside within Alterac's ruins
column2: and I shudder to think what they're doing with the precious books still there. You must recover what you can! Enter the Ruins of Alterac and search for tomes looted by the ogres. Get whatever you can find and bring them to me
column3: but also seek out one book in particular: The Arm of Gri'lek. It contains ancient troll lore that I must learn
column4: and the Ruins of Alterac was the last known location of an intact copy of this book.

column1: Battle of Hillsbrad^30^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^High Executor Darthalia^High Executor Darthalia^Battle of Hillsbrad^^Battle of Hillsbrad^Travel to Dun Garok and kill 8 Mountaineers
column2: 4 Riflemen
column3: 2 Priests and Captain Ironhill and report back to Darthalia in Tarren Mill.^Dwarves aiding the humans? Damn those filthy little beasts. We shall test the strength of the so-called Alliance. We'll see how anxious those little ankle-bashers are to help the humans once they feel our wrath. We know exactly where their stronghold is in this territory. They have established a barracks in southeastern Hillsbrad along Thoradin's Wall called Dun Garok. The final mission of this battle is to lay siege on Dun Garok
column4: <class>. Captain Ironhill
column5: their leader
column6: must die.

column1: Return to Milton^38^Alliance^Stormwind City^Loremaster Dibbs^Milton Sheaf^An Old History Book^^^Bring the Tomes of Alterac to Milton Sheaf in Stormwind.^I need to spend some time studying the Arm of Gri'lek book you brought me
column2: though I'm sure Milton is eager to get the other recovered books into Stormwind's collection. Here are the books you gathered from the Ruins of Alterac
column3: packed and catalogued. Take them back to Milton Sheaf in Stormwind and I'm sure he'll be grateful.

column1: The Perenolde Tiara^40^Alliance^Stormwind City^Count Remington Ridgewell^Count Remington Ridgewell^^^^Bring the Perenolde Tiara to Remington Ridgewell in Stormwind.^The Perenolde Tiara is an old heirloom of the Perenolde "nobles" - the ruling family of Alterac before that kingdom fell to ruin. It is said to have been crafted by master jewelers in Ironforge
column2: and fitted with the finest of emeralds. When Alterac was destroyed the Tiara was lost
column3: but there are rumors that an Ogre Mage
column4: Grel'borg the Miser
column5: found the tiara and now wanders the Ruins of Alterac searching for more treasures. We would have you acquire the tiara for us.

column1: Prison Break In^34^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Magus Wordeen Voidglare^Magus Wordeen Voidglare^Prison Break In^^^Find the traitors and recover their artifacts
column2: then return to Magus Voidglare in Tarren Mill.^I came to Tarren Mill to research
column3: but now must resolve a crisis. You see
column4: four Forsaken fled the Undercity a few months ago. They turned their backs on their brethren
column5: but what's worse...they stole from the Dark Lady. These thieves broke into a secure vault and stole four artifacts
column6: items our apothecaries required in certain studies. Sylvanas would have these artifacts returned. The thieves fled the Undercity to Dalaran
column7: and those wizards quarantined them in the Lordamere Internment Camp.

column1: Dalaran Patrols^35^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Magus Wordeen Voidglare^Magus Wordeen Voidglare^Prison Break In^^^Kill 6 Dalaran Summoners and 12 Elemental Slaves
column2: then return to Magus Voidglare in Tarren Mill.^The wizards of Dalaran constructed a vast
column3: magical dome around the heart of their city. Some believe it was for protection from the violence of these times
column4: while others say they merely wanted solitude
column5: to study and plot. I don't care what the reason was. I do care that the ruined outskirts of their city may hide valuable magical treasures. But the area is patrolled by the wizards and their elemental slaves. So hunt them
column6: and return when their numbers are sufficiently reduced.

column1: Souvenirs of Death^25^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Deathguard Samsa^Deathguard Samsa^^^^Deathguard Samsa of Tarren Mill wants 30 Hillsbrad Human Skulls.^I hear you were enlisted by Darthalia to wage war on the humans of Hillsbrad. So jealous I am. . . While you're off having all the fun -- slaying humans
column2: pillaging the town
column3: terrorizing innocent people -- I am stuck standing guard here in Tarren Mill. Perhaps you'll take pity on an old Deathguard like myself? You see I am collecting human skulls. And you will be fighting humans for quite some time. Over the course of your long battle
column4: bring me 30 skulls and I will make it worth your while.

column1: Humbert's Sword^30^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Deathguard Humbert^Deathguard Humbert^^^^Retrieve Deathguard Humbert's sword from Dun Garok and return it to him in Tarren Mill.^High Executor Darthalia sent me to keep watch of Dun Garok from a distance. I had set up camp just out of sight. But when morning came and I had to boil water
column2: I left to gather firewood. When I returned to camp
column3: I discovered my gear was missing. Apparently some dwarven scouts from Dun Garok had passed by and made off with it. I need my sword! If you can get it back for me I would be so grateful. So many dwarves there...it will be quite difficult to find the dirty little thief who stole it.

column1: WANTED: Syndicate Personnel^22^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^WANTED^High Executor Darthalia^^^^Kill 10 Syndicate Rogues and 10 Syndicate Watchmen. Return to High Executor Darthalia in Tarren Mill for your reward.^By the authority of Lady Sylvanas
column2: all members of the organization known as the Syndicate are wanted dead. Those brought into custody or taken prisoner will be summarily executed. They are currently known to be amassing in the ruins of Durnholde Keep
column3: to the southeast of Tarren Mill. A handsome reward is offered to all who bring proof of their deeds to High Executor Darthalia.

column1: The Ensorcelled Parchment^40^Alliance^Alterac Mountains^Ensorcelled Parchment^Loremaster Dibbs^The Ensorcelled Parchment^^^Take the Ensorcelled Parchment to Loremaster Dibbs at Southshore in Hillsbrad Foothills.^This parchment is enchanted with a spell
column2: rendering it indecipherable. But one word at the top of the paper can be read:  Nagaz

column1: Helcular's Revenge^33^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Novice Thaivand^Novice Thaivand^Helcular's Revenge^^^Retrieve Helcular's Rod from the Yeti and bring it back to Novice Thaivand in Tarren Mill.^Master Helcular was almost complete with his transformation into a Lich when a human lynch mob discovered his ritual lair in the hills and brutally killed him. To make matters worse they buried his corpse in the Southshore cemetery. Such disregard for the great wizard is unacceptable. As his apprentice I shall see to it that the rains of vengeance fall upon the town of Southshore. We will need Helcular's Rod first. Yeti overtook his ritual lair. Undoubtedly one of the beasts has it.
Helcular's Revenge^33^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Novice Thaivand^Helcular's Grave^Helcular's Revenge^^^Charge the Rod of Helcular with the powers of the Flame of Azel
column2: Flame of Veraz and the Flame of Uzel.^Here
column3: take the Rod of Helcular. You will need it. Helcular fashioned 3 ceremonial pyres as part of his most powerful spell. The Flame of Azel and the Flame of Veraz lie within the Foothill Caverns. The Flame of Uzel lies in a cave above the caverns
column4: further north in the mountains. The Rod of Helcular must be charged from each of the three flames. Once the ritual is complete
column5: drive the rod into Helcular's grave in Southshore
column6: the heavily guarded human town to the south. Vengeance shall be ours!

column1: Stormpike's Deciphering^40^Alliance^Alterac Mountains^Loremaster Dibbs^Prospector Stormpike^The Ensorcelled Parchment^^^Take the Ensorcelled Parchment to Prospector Stormpike in Ironforge.^Prospector Stormpike is a master of decryption and deciphering. If you take the parchment you found to him
column2: then with luck he can make sense of it. Stormpike is currently studying in the Prospector headquarters in Ironforge. And when you see him tell him you spoke with me - I've been sending him quite a lot of business lately.

column1: Soothing Turtle Bisque^31^Alliance^Hillsbrad Foothills^Chef Jessen^Chef Jessen^^^^Bring 10 pieces of Turtle Meat to Chef Jessen in Southshore.^If there's one thing you'll learn about Southshore it's that we have some of the best cuisine north of Stormwind! Take my secret recipe for Turtle Bisque
column2: for example. I've known folks to travel from as far as Darkshire just to enjoy a bowl. Speaking of which
column3: I haven't been able to make any lately. I used to head up past Dalaran to Lake Lordamere myself to hunt Snapjaws but it's just too dangerous now. If you bring me some Turtle Meat from the Snapjaws up north
column4: I'll whip some up!

column1: Stone Tokens^32^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Keeper Bel'varil^Keeper Bel'varil^^^Bracers of Binding^Bring 10 Worn Stone Tokens to Keeper Bel'varil in Tarren Mill.^A notable talent of the wizards of Dalaran is their familiarity with elementals: powerful creatures from other dimensions. The wizards use magical tokens as a means to control these elementals. Magus Voidglare would like some of these tokens to study. Enter the territories of the Dalaran wizards
column2: west of Hillsbrad
column3: and gather the tokens. You might find the tokens on any citizen of Dalaran
column4: but I suggest hunting at the internment camp. It's safer than Dalaran itself.

column1: Bracers of Binding^34^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Keeper Bel'varil^Keeper Bel'varil^^Stone Tokens^^Bring 4 Bracers of Earth Binding to Keeper Bel'varil in Tarren Mill.^The Magus will be busy studying those stone tokens you gathered
column2: but I know he'll eventually want examples of their counterpart: bracers of binding. These are set around the wrists of actual elementals
column3: and bind them into the mage's service. Hunt elementals in the ruins of Dalaran and gather their Bracers of Earth Binding
column4: and the Magus will be pleased.

column1: Farren's Proof^32^Alliance^Hillsbrad Foothills^Lieutenant Farren Orinelle^Lieutenant Farren Orinelle^Down the Coast^^^Collect 10 Murloc Heads from the murlocs on the Western Strand for Lieutenant Farren Orinelle in Southshore.^Would you believe it
column2: <name>? Redpath wasn't satisfied with all the murlocs we killed--oh now
column3: don't be modest
column4: you had some hand in it. Now he wants me to bring proof of the dead
column5: hacking off cold
column6: slimy murloc heads to submit for his approval.

column1: Farren's Proof^32^Alliance^Hillsbrad Foothills^Lieutenant Farren Orinelle^Marshal Redpath^Down the Coast^^^Deliver the sack of murloc heads to Marshall Redpath in Southshore.^You know
column2: <name>
column3: I'd really rather not take these heads... Since you've already got a handle on them
column4: would you mind delivering them to Redpath for me?

column1: Farren's Proof^32^All^Hillsbrad Foothills^Marshal Redpath^Lieutenant Farren Orinelle^Down the Coast^^^Speak with Lieutenant Farren Orinelle in Southshore.^Please inform Lieutenant Orinelle that I would like him to refocus his efforts on the naga infesting the Eastern Strand. When he has results
column2: tell him to report to me in person.

column1: Stormwind Ho!^32^Alliance^Hillsbrad Foothills^Lieutenant Farren Orinelle^Lieutenant Farren Orinelle^Down the Coast^^^Kill 10 Daggerspine Shorehunters and 10 Daggerspine Sirens for Lieutenant Farren Orinelle in Southshore.^My former mentor in the Stormwind city guard sent a message to me that Alliance High Command is becoming concerned with the threat posed by the naga. From what he's heard
column2: there's good chances for promotion--or at least reassignment--for anyone who proves valuable in this regard. There's just one small problem... I can't handle the naga
column3: <name>. Oh sure
column4: I could break up a drunken barroom brawl
column5: or haul off a belligerent beggar
column6: but the naga are too much for me. You've got to help me
column7: <name>!

column1: Reassignment^32^Alliance^Hillsbrad Foothills^Lieutenant Farren Orinelle^Major Samuelson^Down the Coast^^^Deliver Farren's report to Major Samuelson in Stormwind Keep.^It shouldn't be a problem getting my report seen. The new captain of the guard
column2: Major Samuelson
column3: was my mentor while I was stationed in Stormwind. It should give him more than enough excuse to have me transferred back to the city. I'll need you to carry my report to him
column4: though... wouldn't want ol' Redpath to catch on.

column1: Costly Menace^34^Alliance^Hillsbrad Foothills^Darren Malvew^Darren Malvew^^^^Darren Malvew of Southshore wants you to kill 8 Mountain Lions and 10 Hulking Mountain Lions.^Ain't nothin' that irks me more than losin' these here beautiful horses. And believe me
column2: we've lost quite a few between them pesky undead creeps
column3: the dang Syndicate gang and all the other good-for-nothin' scoundrels pokin' about these parts. But I swear on my ol' grand-daddy's grave there ain't no bigger menace to our horses here than them Mountain Lions up in Alterac. Always comin' down from the hills and makin' my life difficult! You fancy yourself a hero? Go and do somethin' about it then!

column1: Bartolo's Yeti Fur Cloak^34^Alliance^Hillsbrad Foothills^Bartolo Ginsetti^Bartolo Ginsetti^^^^Bring Bartolo Ginsetti of Southshore a Bolt of Wool
column2: a Hillman's Cloak
column3: Fine Thread and 10 clumps of Yeti Fur.^I
column4: the great Bartolo
column5: shall make for you the world famous
column6: Alliance renowned
column7: Yeti Fur Cloak! Travel the planet and find yourself a better cloak
column8: I dare you. Oh wait
column9: what is that
column10: little <race>? "Bartolo
column11: there is no finer cloak!" Yes
column12: yes! That
column13: I have heard before. Bartolo requires a Bolt of Wool
column14: a Hillman's Cloak made by a skilled leatherworker
column16: of course! Bring to me these items and you shall be a happy customer!

column1: WANTED: Baron Vardus^40^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^WANTED^High Executor Darthalia^^^^Kill Baron Vardus and deliver his head to High Executor Darthalia in Tarren Mill.^By order of High Executor Darthalia
column2: the human known as Baron Vardus is wanted for crimes against the Forsaken. Vardus is known to be a high-ranking member of the organization known as the Syndicate. He was last spotted in the Uplands in the Alterac Mountains
column3: north of Tarren Mill. He is wanted dead. Bring evidence of his demise to High Executor Darthalia to claim the reward.

column1: Dangerous!^28^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Dangerous!^High Executor Darthalia^^^^High Executor Darthalia of Tarren Mill is offering a bounty on Clerk Horrace Whitesteed
column2: Citizen Wilkes
column3: Miner Hackett and Farmer Kalaba.^Dangerous! The following humans of Hillsbrad have been deemed dangerous and are marked for bounty by High Executor Darthalia: Clerk Horrace Whitesteed. Wanted for the murder of Deathguard Toma. Citizen Wilkes. Wanted for the murder of Apothecary Eli. Miner Hackett. Wanted for the murder of Deathstalker Fry. Farmer Kalaba. Wanted for the ambush of supplies from the Undercity. All of these enemies are hiding and will be hard to find. A reward will be granted upon notice of their death.

column1: The Defense of Grom'gol^36^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Commander Aggro'gosh^Commander Aggro'gosh^The Defense of Grom'gol^^^Commander Aggro'gosh of the Grom'gol base camp wants you to kill 15 Lashtail Raptors.^Throm'ka
column2: <class>! Your arrival at Grom'gol is timely
column3: indeed. As commander of the Warchief's base camp here in the jungle I am bound by honor to ensure the safety of all members of the Horde. Our mission to provide a safe chain of supply to Stonard is being hampered by some of the local inhabitants. I am putting you in charge of thinning out the raptor population outside of Grom'gol. Once you have made significant progress
column4: report back to me for reassignment.

column1: The Defense of Grom'gol^37^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Commander Aggro'gosh^Commander Aggro'gosh^The Defense of Grom'gol^^^Commander Aggro'gosh of the Grom'gol base camp wants you to kill 10 Ogre Brutes and 5 Ogre Witch Doctors.^When we first arrived in this jungle we did not intend to wage war on the local tribes. Our mission to supply Stonard is of the highest priority. But complications have arisen. A local band of ogres has occupied the Mizjah Ruins to the southeast of Grom'gol. Despite warnings
column2: they continue to ambush our supply caravans. I am putting you in charge of dealing with these uncooperative ogres. Travel to the ruins and attempt to drive them from the area. At the very least it will send a firm message.

column1: Mok'thardin's Enchantment^38^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Far Seer Mok'thardin^Far Seer Mok'thardin^Mok'thardin's Enchantment^^^Far Seer Mok'thardin at the Grom'gol base camp wants 8 Shadowmaw Claws and a Pristine Tigress Fang.^The power of the jungle's magic must be realized and then harnessed by the Horde. My rituals have proven successful so far. I can cast very powerful enchantments. For you
column2: brave <class>
column3: I shall make a special item indeed. Bring to me some Shadowmaw Panther claws along with a Tigress fang. Not just any fang will do. It must be in pristine condition. The beasts lurk throughout the jungle but you will find some close by
column4: just across the river from Mizjah Ruins to the southeast.

column1: Mok'thardin's Enchantment^41^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Far Seer Mok'thardin^Far Seer Mok'thardin^Mok'thardin's Enchantment^^^Bring an Aged Gorilla Sinew to Far Seer Mok'thardin in Grom'gol.^What I need from you now will be very difficult to obtain. To hold all these feathers
column2: claws and the pristine fang in place I require a magical tether. Only an aged gorilla sinew will work. You will only be able to find one on an Elder Mistvale Gorilla. They are known to forage to the east of Booty Bay. The sinew must be perfect. It might take quite a few kills for you to find exactly what I need but it will be well worth the hunt.

column1: Mok'thardin's Enchantment^41^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Far Seer Mok'thardin^Far Seer Mok'thardin^Mok'thardin's Enchantment^^^Bring 10 Jungle Stalker Feathers to Far Seer Mok'thardin at the Grom'gol base camp.^The items you gathered from the feline beasts of the Vale are only the first requirement for a powerful enchanted item. These jungle trinkets combined with my shamanistic ritual will provide you with a very useful tool in assisting the Horde and the Warchief. But now you must gather for me some Jungle Stalker Feathers. The feathers are traditionally worn by the beasts on their armbands. You will find a tribe of the raptors directly south of Grom'gol
column2: not far from the great arena.

column1: Mok'thardin's Enchantment^44^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Far Seer Mok'thardin^Far Seer Mok'thardin^Mok'thardin's Enchantment^^^Far Seer Mok'thardin of Grom'gol needs Holy Spring Water. He also wants you to kill 10 Naga Explorers.^There is but one final reagent needed to complete the enchantment. In the south
column2: towards the western coast
column3: high above the bluffs
column4: lies a Holy Spring. This spring is the subject of great conflict amongst religious and mystical scholars. Every race in Azeroth claims that the spring waters were made divine for their people. My final request of you: bring to me Holy Spring Water. Be warned. An expedition of naga explorers have advanced upon the spring. They will need to be dealt with as well.

column1: Special Forces^38^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Sergeant Yohwa^Lieutenant Doren^Special Forces^The Second Rebellion
column2: Bad Medicine^^Kill 10 Kurzen Commandoes and 6 Kurzen Headshrinkers.^Now that many of his regular troops are reduced
column3: you must face his highly trained forces. When they're not in the wilderness slaughtering our rebel soldiers
column4: they are found deep in the back of the Kurzen Compound
column5: in a cave they call the Stockpile. I know many of Kurzen's troops personally
column6: and I know they are skilled
column7: loyal
column8: and cruel. This is no easy task I set before you
column9: <name>. After you defeat them
column10: report to Lieutenant Doren
column11: my commanding officer. He will want your report firsthand.

column1: Supply and Demand^31^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Drizzlik^Drizzlik^^^Some Assembly Required^Bring 2 Large River Crocolisk Skins to Drizzlik in Booty Bay.^"The finest leathercrafter of the South Seas and the worlds old and new." That's what they call me. Me! Drizzlik! The finest lea... Ahem. Well. My leather goods are known far and wide as the most exquisite
column2: a connoisseur's choice! I've just received an order from Director Riddlevox of the Tinkers' Union for a dozen of his favorite Excelsior-line boots. Our best sellers
column3: actually. To start on the basic shape
column4: I'll need crocolisk skins from the crocs along the river in northern Stranglethorn.

column1: Keep An Eye Out^42^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Dizzy One-Eye^Dizzy One-Eye^^The Bloodsail Buccaneers^^Dizzy One-Eye in Booty Bay wants you to retrieve his eye from the Bloodsail Buccaneers.^Avast! Who goes there? Argh
column2: I am but useless without me special enchanted eye. Bad enough to have lost me eyes in battle in the first place! But by some stroke o' luck we docked in Menethil and a traveling wizard enchanted a special glass eye that let me see again. Last night I ended up gettin' jumped by some Bloodsail Buccaneers on me way out. Took me eye
column3: they did! Seems those blokes have found their way to Booty Bay. Help an old sea dog out by gettin' me eye back?

column1: Some Assembly Required^36^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Drizzlik^Drizzlik^Some Assembly Required^Supply and Demand^^Bring 5 Snapjaw Crocolisks Skins to Drizzlik in Booty Bay.^Well
column2: I've got the basic shape of the boots worked out
column3: and they're coming along fine
column4: but the skins you brought aren't going to be quite enough for the inner layers. "What are we going to do
column5: Drizzlik?" No doubt the question on your lips
column6: and well
column7: isn't it lucky you're talking to Drizzlik
column8: because he's going to tell you what we're going to do! The inner layers will never really be seen
column9: so we'll just get some of the thicker
column10: cheaper skins from the crocs around Lake Nazferiti to fill the boots out.

column1: The Stone of the Tides^37^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Baron Revilgaz^Baron Revilgaz^The Haunted Isle^^^Find the haunted island for Baron Revilgaz in Booty Bay.^If there is indeed a goblin mage and water elementals haunting the island
column2: it could mean the Stone of the Tides can be mine! I want you to locate this haunted island... find out what's going on. Oh
column3: and if you perhaps want to find out more about the Stone of the Tides
column4: take this scrip to the Stormwind Library
column5: they should be able to find you a copy of the book I first came across the legend in. Could it be that Gazban actually discovered the Stone...?

column1: Whiskey Slim's Lost Grog^50^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Whiskey Slim^Whiskey Slim^^^^Whiskey Slim in Booty Bay wants you to bring him the bottles of Pupellyverbos Port he lost.^We was splicin' the mainbrace somethin' fierce off of the Overlook Cliffs
column2: ol' Hinterlands just in the distance. Thought the seas was goin' to swallow us whole. Ol' Slim knows all about liquid courage! Cap'n had a crate of Pupellyverbos Port we commandeered from a privateer en route to Stormwind. So when that storm off of Hinterlands hit
column3: I busted into the grog. Big wave hit and tossed them bottles overboard. Cap'n is goin' to give me a taste o' the cat if ye don't help me get 'em back though!

column1: Hunt for Yenniku^34^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Nimboya^Nimboya^Hunt for Yenniku^^^Bring 9 Bloodscalp Tusks to Nimboya at the Grom'gol Base Camp.^A doom
column2: there is. A doom on my chief's youngest son
column3: Yenniku. As is a custom with our people
column4: he was given to the Gurubashi Trolls of Zul'Gurub
column5: but after my tribe
column6: the Darkspear tribe
column7: left with the orc Thrall
column8: poor Yenniku was lost to us. I was sent from distant Orgrimmar
column9: back to Stranglethorn
column10: to search for my chief's son. And I believe the Bloodscalp tribe has him. If you would help me
column11: then hunt the Bloodscalps. You may find them to the north. Gather their tusks and return to me.

column1: Headhunting^37^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Nimboya^Nimboya^Hunt for Yenniku^^Bloodscalp Clan Heads^Bring 20 Shrunken Heads to Nimboya at the Grom'gol Base Camp.^We must find if Yenniku is dead. Slay the Bloodscalp Headhunters and take from them their Shrunken Heads. You must gather many
column2: many heads
column3: and I will inspect them to make sure Yenniku's head is not among them. And if Yenniku was killed by the Bloodscalps
column4: then may a 600-year curse fall on the spirit of their chief
column5: Gan'zulah! Go
column6: <name>. You may find many Headhunters at the ruins of Zuuldaia and Zul'Kunda
column7: along the coast to the north.

column1: Welcome to the Jungle^30^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Barnil Stonepot^Hemet Nesingwary Jr.^^^Tiger Mastery
column2: Panther Mastery
column3: Raptor Mastery
column4: The Green Hills of Stranglethorn^Speak with Hemet Nesingwary Jr.^Welcome to Stranglethorn! Perhaps you're not aware of this
column5: but that dwarf over there is the son of the one and only Hemet Nesingwary
column6: renowned war hero of the Alliance and master big game hunter. Like his father
column7: he's not one for welcoming strangers into his camp
column8: but you look like you've seen quite a bit of action in your day
