column9: <class>. Go and speak with him. He's a chip off the old block
column10: so perhaps he can give you some hunting pointers.

column1: Bloodscalp Clan Heads^41^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Nimboya^Bubbling Cauldron^^Headhunting^Speaking with Nezzliok
column2: Speaking with Gan'zulah^Bring Gan'zulah's Head and Nezzliok's Head to the bubbling cauldron at the Grom'gol Base Camp.^Yenniku was not among the heads
column3: and I thank the Great Serpent for it. But we are no closer to finding him. We must know the truth
column4: and I fear that only the Bloodscalp chief and his witchdoctor know it. They are the enemies of the Darkspear tribe and will not speak freely
column5: so we must force the truth from their dead lips! Bring me the heads of Gan'zulah and Nezzliok the Dire and place them within this cauldron. They are deep within Zul'Kunda. Bring their heads...we will then make them talk.

column1: Speaking with Nezzliok^40^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Bubbling Cauldron^Bubbling Cauldron^^Bloodscalp Clan Heads^The Fate of Yenniku^Bring a Balia'mah Trophy
column2: a Ziata'jai Trophy and a Zul'Mamwe Trophy to the Bubbling Cauldron at the Grom'gol Base Camp.^<The head of Nezzliok speaks.> It is true. I know where the child of the Darkspears was taken. You have bested me and bound my spirit
column3: but I will say nothing without appeasement! The Bloodscalps war with the Skullsplitters. To gain my favor
column4: steal from the Skullsplitters 3 of their trophy skulls and place them here with us
column5: so that my spirit will have slaves in the Nether. One skull must be from their trophy pile in Balia'mah
column6: another from Ziata'jai
column7: and the last from Zul'Mamwe.

column1: Speaking with Gan'zulah^46^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Bubbling Cauldron^Bubbling Cauldron^^Bloodscalp Clan Heads^The Fate of Yenniku^Kill 8 Skullsplitter Hunters
column2: 6 Skullsplitter Headhunters
column3: and 4 Skullsplitter Berserkers.^<The head of Gan'zulah speaks.> Curse you! And curse your ancestors!! Only blood and revenge can cool my rage
column4: so if that is your wish
column5: then... do this: Throw yourself into the heart of the Skullsplitters to the east. Slay the fiercest among them
column6: and if you survive...then break yourself against their chief
column7: Ana'thek the Cruel. Hah! Bring me his shattered armor if you can! May he tear off your limbs and leave you to rot and be eaten by carrion.

column1: Up to Snuff^41^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Deeg^Deeg^^The Bloodsail Buccaneers^^Deeg in Booty Bay wants you to bring him 15 shares of Snuff.^Ah
column2: the sea life. I ain't gonna say it's the good life
column3: but it's my life. When I get into port I like to find me a good bottle of grog and some high quality snuff. Nasty habits but what's a pirate without his vices
column4: right? So you can imagine how heartbroken I was to find out the herbalist here in town has gone and sold out of the stuff. Says his shipment got hijacked by those damned Bloodsail Raiders. I bet a fearless <class> like you could convince 'em to share the goods
column5: eh?

column1: The Fate of Yenniku^45^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Bubbling Cauldron^Kin'weelay^The Fate of Yenniku^Speaking with Nezzliok
column2: Speaking with Gan'zulah^^Speak with Kin'weelay.^<Nezzliok speaks.> You have appeased myself and my chief
column3: so I will tell you that which you seek to discover... Young Yenniku is lost to his clan. He was taken by the witchdoctor Zanzil the Outcast. Now Zanzil controls him
column4: body and soul
column5: and only the most potent magic could set him free. A magic that you do not have
column6: <class>. Perhaps your Darkspear allies can offer a hope of Yenniku's salvation. But that
column7: I doubt.

column1: The Singing Crystals^45^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Kin'weelay^Kin'weelay^The Fate of Yenniku^^^Bring 3 Pulsing Blue Shards to Kin'weelay at the Grom'gol Base Camp.^Legends tell of a jewel
column2: hidden deep in the heart of Stranglethorn. We call it the Mind's Eye
column3: and it has great powers. If you gain this Eye then
column4: perhaps
column5: we can use it to bring lost Yenniku back from the darkness. I will consult with the spirits of the jungle to find the Mind's Eye. While I do this
column6: you enter the Crystalvein Mine
column7: southeast of here
column8: and gather Pulsing Blue Shards from Ironjaw Basilisks. The shards are rare
column9: but we will need their magic to bend the Mind's Eye to our will.

column1: A Rogue's Deal^5^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Calvin Montague^Calvin Montague^^A Rogue's Deal^^Defeat Calvin Montague in Deathknell.^What? What?! You want money? I don't owe you any money. Letter? What letter? Oh
column2: you wanna fight then? All right
column3: mate... let's do this! Owe you any money...

column1: The Mind's Eye^46^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Kin'weelay^Kin'weelay^The Fate of Yenniku^^Saving Yenniku^Bring the Mind's Eye to Kin'weelay at the Grom'gol Base Camp.^The Mind's Eye is held by an ogre mage
column2: east of here and deep within the Mosh'Ogg ogre mound. His name is Mai'Zoth. I know him from when the Darkspears dwelt in Stranglethorn - he is vicious
column3: and his magic is strong. And if he has the Mind's Eye
column4: then his magic will be stronger still. You must face Mai'Zoth and wrest from him the Mind's Eye. It is a perilous task
column5: but it is the only hope we have of saving Yenniku.

column1: Saving Yenniku^46^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Kin'weelay^Nimboya^^The Mind's Eye^^Bring the Filled Soul Gem to Nimboya.^I have reshaped the Mind's Eye into a Soul Gem. Its purpose is twofold: you must use it to stun Yenniku
column2: and once stunned place it upon his head to entrap his soul. Then
column3: bring the gem to Nimboya. Yenniku dwells with Zanzil the Outcast
column4: at the Ruins of Aboraz
column5: along the Crystal Shore on the distant Cape of Stranglethorn.

column1: Message in a Bottle^42^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Carefully Folded Note^Princess Poobah^Message in a Bottle^^^Find the author of the message in a bottle.^The note reads
column2: in fairly good handwriting: To any that can aid me- Please
column3: my need for help is dire. A great Skymane holds me captive on an island in the South Seas. The stars at night are foreign to me and obscured by the jungle trees
column4: but on the clearest days I see Wild Shore to the northwest
column5: and what seem to be large sailing ships to the southwest. I beg of you
column6: my would-be savior
column7: please help me.

column1: The Bloodsail Buccaneers^41^All^Stranglethorn Vale^First Mate Crazz^Bloodsail Correspondence^The Bloodsail Buccaneers^^Keep An Eye Out
column2: Up to Snuff^First Mate Crazz wants you to check the cove north of Booty Bay.^You sure seem eager to work
column3: matey. Not sure why some land-loving <race> <class> is offering help to the Blackwater Raiders
column4: but I'm not going to turn you away. Our ship just docked here in Booty Bay and word has it that our rivals--those damned
column5: dirty Bloodsail Buccaneers--have been spotted all over southern Stranglethorn. All the boys are too busy hitting the grog and looking for ladies! What I need is a scout. Check the cove just north of Booty Bay along the Savage Coast and see what you find.

column1: Bloody Bone Necklaces^37^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Kin'weelay^Kin'weelay^^^Split Bone Necklace^Bring 25 Bloody Bone Necklaces to Kin'weelay at the Grom'gol Base Camp.^I was sent to Grom'gol to aid Nimboya on his quest
column2: but... I too have reasons for being here. The Bloodscalp tribe is enemy to our tribe. Collecting trophies of our enemies gives us power over them. You may aid our tribe by hunting our enemies. They dwell to the north. Slay Bloodscalp trolls and take from them their bloody bone necklaces. Collect many
column3: and your reward will be great.

column1: The Bloodsail Buccaneers^41^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Bloodsail Correspondence^First Mate Crazz^The Bloodsail Buccaneers^^^Report your findings to First Mate Crazz in Booty Bay.^The map shows Booty Bay with a red "X" drawn precisely at the spot at which you are standing. The scribbled text reads: "You men are to secure a camp at this location and keep quiet. Wait for the signal from the southern command post before attacking. If anyone approaches you
column2: kill them."

column1: Split Bone Necklace^42^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Kin'weelay^Kin'weelay^^Bloody Bone Necklaces^^Bring 25 Split Bone Necklaces to Kin'weelay at the Grom'gol Base camp.^Now that you have gathered Bloodscalp trophies
column2: I have another task for you. The Skullsplitter tribe of trolls live to the southeast
column3: and for years we have warred with them. Although the Darkspears no longer dwell in Stranglethorn
column4: we are bound to our conflict with the Skullsplitters. So
column5: hunt them. Gather their Split Bone Necklaces and return to me. Aid us in our war
column6: and you will earn the friendship of the Darkspears.

column1: The Bloodsail Buccaneers^41^All^Stranglethorn Vale^First Mate Crazz^Fleet Master Seahorn^The Bloodsail Buccaneers^^^Report the planned Bloodsail attack to Fleet Master Seahorn.^Shiver me timbers! So the Bloodsail Buccaneers are planning some sort of attack on Booty Bay? Why
column2: the nerve of those scoundrels. Booty Bay will always be run by the Blackwater Raiders! This is bigger than I thought. Report what you have learned to Fleet Master Seahorn at once! The ol' sea dog is around town somewhere....

column1: Venture Company Mining^41^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Crank Fizzlebub^Crank Fizzlebub^Singing Blue Shards^^^Bring 10 Singing Blue Crystals to Crank Fizzlebub in Booty Bay.^The Venture Company has a string of operations through Stranglethorn which keeps hard-working goblins
column2: like me
column3: from making honest gold! Please
column4: you must help me! The Venture Company is mining near the Crystalvein Mine to the north. They can't get into the mine because of all the basilisks
column5: but they're still able to dig up Singing Crystals from the surrounding hills. Take their crystals from them
column6: and show them they don't have the run of the jungle. And... um... bring me those crystals as proof!

column1: Water Elementals^37^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Baron Revilgaz^Baron Revilgaz^The Haunted Isle^^^Acquire 6 Water Elemental Bracers for Baron Revilgaz in Booty Bay.^The water elementals were no doubt summoned by Gazban
column2: the goblin wizard rumored to have discovered the Stone of the Tides. As you may know
column3: the Stone of the Tides curses its bearer
column4: causing him to fade in and out of existence... Perhaps we can find a way to counteract the curse. We can have a mage of Dalaran analyze the magical residue of one of the water elemental's bracers. I need you to go back to the island and retrieve a few specimens.

column1: Magical Analysis^37^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Baron Revilgaz^Archmage Ansirem Runeweaver^The Haunted Isle^^Ansirem's Key^Bring the water elemental bracers to Archmage Ansirem Runeweaver in Dalaran Crater.^From what I've heard
column2: the mages of Dalaran have succeeded in rebuilding their magical city and moving it to Northrend
column3: leaving behind a massive crater. Some mages remained here though
column4: who should spare some time to look at the bracers. If there's anything I know about mages
column5: they can't resist a magical puzzle. Take the bag of water elemental bracers and see if they can shed any light on the Stone's curse. Look for the Archmage Ansirem Runeweaver. I've dealt with him before
column6: and his knowledge is vast.

column1: Ansirem's Key^37^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Archmage Ansirem Runeweaver^Catelyn the Blade^Ansirem's Key^Magical Analysis^^Talk to Catelyn in Booty Bay.^The mage that is in possession of the Stone is amplifying its power through some focal point... an altar of some sort. You should be able to disrupt it by overpowering it. As it happens
column2: I know just the thing: an ancient dagger
column3: another troll relic. There's just one... little problem. You see
column4: I found the dagger while researching in Stranglethorn
column5: but I gave it to my willful daughter
column6: Catelyn
column7: who ran off to Booty Bay to become a pirate.

column1: The Bloodsail Buccaneers^42^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Fleet Master Seahorn^Fleet Master Seahorn^The Bloodsail Buccaneers^^^Fleet Master Seahorn in Booty Bay wants you to kill 10 Bloodsail Swashbucklers and bring back the Bloodsail Charts and the Bloodsail Orders.^Crazz speaks highly of your dedication to the Blackwater Raiders. I am going to trust you with a mission of extreme importance to the fleet. Infiltrate the so-called southern command post the Bloodsail Buccaneers have established on the Wild Shore. Raid the encampment. Bring me their charts along with their written orders. We shall see exactly what those scum are up to.

Singing Blue Shards^35^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Crank Fizzlebub^Crank Fizzlebub^Singing Blue Shards^^^Bring 10 Singing Crystal Shards to Crank Fizzlebub.^The Singing Crystals are unique to Stranglethorn
column2: and are very valuable to certain parties. I can move those crystals
column3: but the cursed Venture Company makes it hard for an honest entrepreneur like myself to gather any! I'd like to hire you. The basilisks in Stranglethorn eat the crystal. This gives them their hardened skin
column4: and sometimes decent quality crystal can be harvested from it. You can get it from any basilisk
column5: but the less nasty ones are along the shores south of Zul'Kunda
column6: to the north.

column1: Scaring Shaky^41^All^Stranglethorn Vale^"Sea Wolf" MacKinley^"Shaky" Phillipe^Scaring Shaky^^^Bring 5 Mistvale Giblets to "Shaky" Phillipe in Booty Bay.^If there's one thing I can't stand
column2: it's people who don't pay their gambling debts! And there are a lot of people who owe me. Think you can help me collect? First
column3: there's "Shaky" Phillipe down by the docks. He owes me plenty after last week's game and I want my due! But to get it
column4: we'll have to scare him. Go out of town and hunt Elder Mistvale Gorillas. Find a nice selection of giblets
column5: then take them to Shaky. Don't let on that they're from an animal; let him think the worst.

column1: Return to MacKinley^41^All^Stranglethorn Vale^"Shaky" Phillipe^"Sea Wolf" MacKinley^Scaring Shaky^^^Bring Shaky's Payment to "Sea Wolf" MacKinley.^Here
column2: take this pouch and give it to Sea Wolf. And tell him I meant to pay him back! I swear!! I just got a little drunk and lost my way
column3: and...you know how things are. He'll understand - you don't have to get rough!

column1: The Bloodsail Buccaneers^42^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Fleet Master Seahorn^Fleet Master Seahorn^The Bloodsail Buccaneers^^^Fleet-Master Seahorn in Booty Bay wants you to kill Captain Stillwater
column2: Captain Keelhaul and Fleet Master Firallon.^Blast the nerve of Firallon! He couldn't sail a skiff through Crystal Lake let alone lead an entire fleet against us. The Bloodsail Buccaneers will pay for their carelessness. Now that we know their plan of attack
column3: we can counter before they know what hit them. But why send the entire fleet to do the work of one brave adventuring party? <name>
column4: take some of your most skilled comrades out to Firallon's landing spot and assassinate the Bloodsail leadership. Their fleet will sink soon after....

column1: Voodoo Dues^44^All^Stranglethorn Vale^"Sea Wolf" MacKinley^"Sea Wolf" MacKinley^Scaring Shaky^^Cracking Maury's Foot^Bring Maury's Clubbed Foot
column2: Jon-Jon's Golden Spyglass
column3: and Chucky's Huge Ring to "Sea Wolf" MacKinley in Booty Bay.^My list is shortening
column4: but there are still people who owe me. Next
column5: we have Maury "Club Foot" Wilkins
column6: Jon-Jon the Crow
column7: and Chucky "Ten Thumbs." These scurvy dogs' debts are months outstanding and I thought they skipped town to avoid paying up! Later
column8: I heard they're cursed and bewitched and now wander the jungle ruins. But I don't care what their fate is - I want what's mine! They're at the Ruins of Aboraz and the Ruins of Jubuwal
column9: northeast of here. Find them
column10: and collect.

column1: Pretty Boy Duncan^39^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Catelyn the Blade^Catelyn the Blade^Ansirem's Key^^^Get Catelyn's dagger from "Pretty Boy" Duncan.^My FATHER sent you? I'd have thought that old codger would have given up on me by now. It wasn't really his fault I ran off
column2: he just shouldn't have expected I'd be willing to live a boring life
column3: reading over musty books and associating with grey-haired
column4: stiff-backed
column5: stuffy mages! If you need my dagger
column6: you'll have to get it back from "Pretty Boy" Duncan
column7: one of the Bloodsail Buccaneers. Put something 'tween his shoulders and I'm sure he'll give it up.

column1: The Curse of the Tides^40^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Catelyn the Blade^Baron Revilgaz^Ansirem's Key^^^Destroy the Altar of the Tides with Catelyn's Blade
column2: kill Gazban and bring the Stone of the Tides and Catelyn's Blade back to Baron Revilgaz.^So you're looking for an altar of some sort? Well
column3: I'm no expert on troll ruins like my father
column4: but I have heard about a sunken troll city out near that island you're looking for. Maybe you should try there. You got my knife back for me
column5: so I guess you can borrow it... but I want it back when you're done!

column1: Cracking Maury's Foot^44^All^Stranglethorn Vale^"Sea Wolf" MacKinley^"Sea Wolf" MacKinley^^Voodoo Dues^^Bring Maury's Key to "Sea Wolf" Mackinley in Booty Bay.^Curses! That swab Maury put a lock on his foot
column2: and I can't open it! His loot's inside the foot
column3: and that's what he owes me! We need to find the key to open the lock. Maury was known to gamble with the Mosh'Ogg ogres
column4: at their mound to the northeast. And he told me
column5: when he was still alive
column6: that the last time he went to the mound he was chased off after winning too much. Maybe the Ogres there have his key. But if they do
column7: you might have to kill a load of them to find the right one...

column1: The Captain's Chest^42^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Captain Hecklebury Smotts^Captain Hecklebury Smotts^^^^Bring Smotts' Chest to Hecklebury Smotts in Booty Bay.^I used to sail a ship from here all the way to Ratchet
column2: in Kalimdor. I was a successful captain with a sterling reputation. Until... Those cursed sea giants ruined me! They smashed my ship
column3: killed my crew
column4: and set me on a lifeboat to Booty Bay. And one of the giants
column5: Gorlash
column6: stole my Captain's Chest. He said he wanted it for a snuffbox. The nerve! I hear Gorlash wanders the coast east of here. Find him and get back my chest! Do that
column7: and you'll have earned a captain's gratitude.

column1: The Haunted Isle^37^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Krazek^Baron Revilgaz^The Haunted Isle^^^Speak with Baron Revilgaz in Booty Bay.^Baron Revilgaz has had me keep an ear out for rumors of the strange and out-of-place in Booty Bay and Stranglethorn. I don't usually put much stock in ghost stories
column2: but I heard some sailors in the tavern talking about a haunted island off the coast. Water elementals and a raving goblin ghost
column3: they say. If you're going to go talk to Revilgaz
column4: could you relay that story to him?

column1: Akiris by the Bundle^43^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Privateer Bloads^Privateer Bloads^^^Akiris by the Bundle^Bring 10 Bundles of Akiris Reed to Privateer Bloads in Booty Bay.^You looking fer work
column2: <name>? I might have some if you're up for a little challenge. I got a friend named Groy who makes a killing selling what the naga call akiris reed: it's some kind of valuable ocean reed. Not too sure what it's for
column3: but he pays well for bundles of the stuff. Ya bring me ten stalks of the stuff
column4: and we'll have business to do. The naga were last seen along the beach to the north of here.

column1: Facing Negolash^42^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Sprogger^Captain Hecklebury Smotts^^The Captain's Cutlass^^Bring 10 Barbecued Buzzard Wings and 5 bottles of Junglevine Wine to Captain Smotts' Lifeboat.^Negolash is a hungry giant. When the giants destroyed our ship
column2: Negolash went straight for my kitchen. He wasn't hungry for crew like the other giants. Negolash wanted wine...and my Barbecued Buzzard Wings. They're my specialty
column3: and I had to go all the way to the Badlands for the recipe! If you want to lure the giant
column4: then get some wine and a heap of buzzard wings. Put them in our old lifeboat
column5: southeast of here along the coast. When Negolash smells all that food
column6: he'll come for sure!

column1: Zanzil's Secret^44^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Crank Fizzlebub^Crank Fizzlebub^^^Zanzil's Mixture and a Fool's Stout^Bring 12 samples of Zanzil's Mixture to Crank Fizzlebub in Booty Bay.^Zanzil the Outcast dwells with his followers in the Jubuwal and Aboraz Ruins
column2: northeast of Booty Bay. He is exiled from his tribe. Why? Well... Zanzil has methods of bending the minds of others
column3: and his leaders fear him. He uses a mixture of jungle plants on his followers to suppress their will and strengthen their bodies. His mixture would be worth much to those who wish to control others. Bring me samples of his mixture
column4: and I will find a use for them.

column1: Return to Corporal Kaleb^37^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Krazek^Corporal Kaleb^Krazek's Cookery^^^Bring Krazek's Fixed Pot to Corporal Kaleb at the Rebel Camp.^While you were gone I fixed the pot you brought me. I even added an extra steam whistle
column2: and look! There's a new chopper at the bottom that'll cut through leg bones! Yes yes
column3: Krazek's Crock Pot is a 100% cook pleaser! I'm sure its owner will be satisfied.

column1: Akiris by the Bundle^43^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Privateer Bloads^Privateer Groy^^Akiris by the Bundle^^Bring a Bundle of Akiris Reeds to Privateer Groy in Theramore.^<name>
column2: since I have you here
column3: I got a message from Groy while you were gone. He mentioned bein' satisfied with the last shipment that arrived and has a client that wants some more of the stuff right away. I won't be headin' to Theramore for a week
column4: but if you're willin' to make the journey
column5: there's no reason you can't take the stuff for me. Feeling adventurous? You do know where Dustwallow Marsh is
column6: doncha? I'd be careful though
column7: Theramore can be dangerous if you're the wrong kind of crowd.

column1: Cortello's Riddle^43^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Cortello's Riddle^A Soggy Scroll^Cortello's Riddle^^^Solve the riddle!^There is an ornate
column2: well-traveled bridgeEast of Deadwind and south of RedridgeUnderneath there waits something for youSome call it a hint
column3: others a clueThere it will lie for endless tomorrowsBiding its time in the Swamp of Sorrows

column1: Cortello's Riddle^43^All^Stranglethorn Vale^A Soggy Scroll^Musty Scroll^Cortello's Riddle^^^Solve the riddle!^A far off land in Kalimdor awaitsWhere peril has dashed hopes and fatesEast of Barrens the weather is harshGloom and danger pock Dustwallow MarshBut there lies a clue for those up to the testWaiting to be found in a cave in the southwest

Cortello's Riddle^51^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Musty Scroll^Cortello's Treasure^Cortello's Riddle^^^Solve the riddle!^To Lordaeron! The great land of turmoilWhere brave soldiers with death do toilFind your way through the great unrestThere you will find the end to this questAlong the coast of the Hinterlands
column2: at the base of the great fallsUnderneath the water there does your treasure call!

column1: Favor for Krazek^37^Alliance^Stranglethorn Vale^Krazek^Krazek^Krazek's Cookery^^^Bring 4 loads of Lesser Bloodstone Ore to Krazek in Booty Bay.^There is a mountain cave in Drywhisker Gorge
column2: far to the north in the Arathi Highlands. In that cave is rare ore: bloodstone. The bloodstone in this cave is not of the highest grade
column3: but even low-quality bloodstone is valuable... to those with the knowledge to use it. I would like some. I will fix your crock pot
column4: but while I work on it... bring me samples of bloodstone. Bring me enough
column5: and I'll even give you a bonus. Oh
column6: and if you don't have the skill to mine it... find someone who does!

column1: Excelsior^38^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Drizzlik^Drizzlik^Some Assembly Required^^^Bring an Elder Crocolisk Skin to Drizzlik in Booty Bay.^With the inside finished
column2: all that's left is to add the outer layer. For this
column3: I use only the best elder croc skins. They are more durable and a better canvas--if you will--for adding the designs and accents that make Drizzlik's Excelsior line. It's hard to find that perfect skin though
column4: the only one that fits my plan is the skin of an elder saltwater crocolisk. The elders only come out to defend the other saltwater crocs
column5: so you might need to kill a few to draw one out.

column1: The Vile Reef^37^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Kin'weelay^Kin'weelay^^^^Bring a Tablet Shard to Kin'weelay at the Grom'gol Base Camp.^Long ago
column2: a great shudder of the earth sunk an old troll city beneath the waters of the Savage Coast to the northwest. We call that place the Vile Reef
column3: for murlocs now reside in the ruins of the city
column4: attacking any who draw close. There is an old tablet among those ruins that tells the ancient tale of Gri'lek
column5: a hero of troll legends. The tale is sacred to the Darkspear tribe
column6: and although the tablet is too large to move
column7: I want a shard of it to enshrine in our new home in Orgrimmar.

column1: Message in a Bottle^42^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Princess Poobah^Princess Poobah^Message in a Bottle^^^Slay King Mukla and return to Princess Poobah with the Key to free her.^<name>
column2: I put my faith in you and anyone you can muster to help free me. The great Skymane King Mukla is my captor. He commands the beasts of this island
column3: and they keep me here against my will with the aid of this chain. If you can slay him and find the key to this shackle
column4: I shall be indebted to you greatly. I often hear him to the southeast side of the island
column5: but please be careful: he is not to be trifled with.

column1: The Thandol Span^31^Alliance^Wetlands^Rhag Garmason^Ebenezer Rustlocke's Corpse^The Thandol Span^^^Rhag Garmason wants you to locate Ol' Rustlocke.^A tremendous explosion roared through the hills. 'Twas horrible
column2: I tell you! Good soldiers died defending the Thandol Span. Longbraid says we'll take revenge on the Dark Irons before all is said and done. We're in a world of hurt though and I don't see any reinforcements in sight. Longbraid sent Ol' Rustlocke to scout the eastern bridge to see if we could secure it. That was days ago. We haven't the manpower to search for him with Dun Modr under siege. Perhaps you can find him...

column1: The Thandol Span^31^Alliance^Wetlands^Ebenezer Rustlocke's Corpse^Rhag Garmason^The Thandol Span^^^Report back to Rhag Garmason at Dun Modir in Wetlands and show him the parchment you found on Rustlocke's corpse.^It seems as though poor Ol' Rustlocke ran into a Dark Iron ambush. You notice a parchment next to his clenched fist. Report the grim news to Rhag Garmason and show him what you found.

The Thandol Span^31^Alliance^Wetlands^Rhag Garmason^Rhag Garmason^The Thandol Span^^^Destroy the cache of explosives.^Heavens no! Poor Rustlocke. 'Tis quite a tragedy indeed. We must not let his death pass in vain. This parchment you discovered indicates that Kam Deepfury
column2: the mastermind behind the original attack
column3: arranged for a cache of explosives to be stashed just across the Thandol Span
column4: in Arathi Highlands. If those explosives make it to the bridge
column5: our major supply line to the north will be severed! The cache must be destroyed
column6: <name>! Return to me when your mission is complete. You're our only hope.

column1: Plea To The Alliance^31^Alliance^Wetlands^Rhag Garmason^Captain Nials^The Thandol Span^^^Seek out Captain Nials at Refuge Pointe in Arathi Highlands.^I ask of you one more small favor
column2: <class>. We await the reserves of Ironforge. However
column3: Roggo has knowledge of an Alliance camp to the north in Arathi Highlands at Refuge Pointe. Travel there and seek out Captain Nials. Ask the good Captain if the Alliance can spare some soldiers to help us reclaim Dun Modr and the Thandol Span.

column1: Crystal in the Mountains^35^All^Arathi Highlands^Pendant of Myzrael^Shards of Myzrael^^^^Find the crystal from your vision.^This shard pulses as you hold it... You feel a sense of pleading coming from the shard
column2: as if someone is trying to communicate
column3: someone who desperately needs your help. A vision appears in your mind - of the northern mountains of Arathi
column4: and of a brilliant crystal jutting from the earth there. You feel drawn to that place.

column1: Sully Balloo's Letter^30^Alliance^Ironforge^Waterlogged Envelope^Sara Balloo^^^Sara Balloo's Plea^Deliver Sully Balloo's Letter to Sara Balloo.^The waterlogged and war-torn envelope dissolves in your hands
column2: leaving you with a few pages of a letter in your grasp
column3: written with painstaking care. The letter is addressed to a Mrs. Sara Balloo of Ironforge and begins
column4: "My dear Sara...."

column1: Trollbane^37^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Nimboya^Zengu^Trollbane^^^Travel to Hammerfall in the Arathi Highlands and speak with Zengu.^With Thoras Trollbane dead and Stromgarde in ruins
column2: Vol'jin has instructed that we make every effort to spirit the legendary sword Trol'kalar from the humans' hands
column3: so that we might use it in our coming battles against the trolls of Zul'Gurub. Zengu
column4: one of our seasoned hunters
column5: was dispatched to Hammerfall in northeastern Arathi Highlands to oversee its procurement.

column1: Sigil of Strom^37^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Zengu^Zengu^Trollbane^^^Get the Sigil of Strom for Zengu in Hammerfall.^In ancient times
column2: trolls fought against the Arathorian Empire and our most capable adversary
column3: Lord Ignaeus of Strom
column4: named Trollbane. He rode into battle wielding Trol'kalar--troll slayer
column5: in their ancient tongue. But now the sons of Trollbane are weakened
column6: their stronghold brought to ruin. The sword is protected by several sigils that were divided among the survivors of Stromgarde
column7: and we must retrieve them. The first was taken by the Syndicate
column8: one of their men in Stromgarde should have it.

column1: The Broken Sigil^40^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Zengu^Tor'gan^Trollbane^^Sigil of Thoradin^Retrieve the 5 Sigil Fragments from the defenders in Stromgarde
column2: and bring them to Tor'gan in Hammerfall.^Thoras Trollbane's tomb is protected by three sigils--the first of which you retrieved from the Syndicate. The other two will be harder to get
column3: as they're held by the firmly entrenched Stromgarde militia. The sigil of Thoradin was divided into five pieces by Thoras' son
column4: Galen
column5: and dispersed among the Stromgarde defenders. Retrieve the pieces and bring them to Tor'gan
column6: the troll shaman
column7: he will be able to bind them into the complete sigil.

column1: Sigil of Thoradin^40^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Tor'gan^Zengu^Sigil of Thoradin^The Broken Sigil^^Bring the restored Sigil of Thoradin to Zengu in Hammerfall.^The reconstruction worked flawlessly. The sigil can now be used to unlock the seal on Trollbane's tomb. Return it to Zengu
column2: no doubt he has additional tasks for you to complete.

column1: The Princess Trapped^37^All^Arathi Highlands^Shards of Myzrael^Iridescent Shards^The Princess Trapped^^^Gather 12 Motes of Myzrael
column2: then bring them to the Iridescent Shards in Drywhisker Gorge.^My name is Myzrael. I am a princess of the earth
column3: and my captors
column4: the giants
column5: have trapped me deep beneath the Arathi Highlands. These crystal shards are the only way I can speak with the surface world. Please help me. Allies of the giants
column6: the Drywhisker Kobolds
column7: have a shard like this one in their Drywhisker Gorge
column8: to the east. To power the cluster
column9: you must gather Motes of Myzrael from the kobolds and apply them to it. I beg you
column10: <name>
column11: aid me!

column1: Sigil of Arathor^41^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Zengu^Zengu^Sigil of Thoradin^^^Retrieve the Sigil of Arathor and return it to Zengu in Hammerfall.^Though they can barely be said to control Stromgarde
column2: let alone the whole of Arathi Highlands
column3: the human prince trots the remnants of his cavalry over the countryside. I can't understand why he does it
column4: but who understands the way the humans think
column5: hm? Whatever his reasoning
column6: more importantly
column7: he has given one of the sigils to Lieutenant Valorcall
column8: their cavalry leader. Locate him and bring his sigil back to me.

column1: Sigil of Trollbane^42^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Zengu^Zengu^Sigil of Thoradin^^^Kill Prince Galen Trollbane and bring the Sigil of Trollbane to Zengu in Hammerfall.^The final of the sigils needed to unlock the tomb of Thoras Trollbane is held by his son personally. He resides deep within Stromgarde
column2: in a chapel in the militia-held districts. Prince Galen is well protected and no slouch of a warrior himself
column3: so this task could prove most difficult.

column1: Trol'kalar^42^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Zengu^Trollbane's Tomb^Sigil of Thoradin^^^Retrieve Trol'kalar from Trollbane's tomb in Stromgarde.^What's this? With the four sigils brought together
column2: they have formed together to create one sigil. There can be no doubt that this will be able to break the wardings placed upon Trollbane's tomb. Trollbane's remains are entombed in the Sanctum behind the chapel in Stromgarde. Retrieve Trol'kalar.

column1: Trol'kalar^42^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Trollbane's Tomb^Zengu^Sigil of Thoradin^^^Deliver Trol'kalar to Zengu in Hammerfall.^The light slowly fades
column2: the sword Trol'kalar
column3: held within a stone sheath has been released.

column1: MacKreel's Moonshine^30^Alliance^Wetlands^Foggy MacKreel^Brewmeister Bilger^^^^Take MacKreel's Moonshine to Brewmeister Bilger in Southshore.^Had quite a bit of the ol' Moonshine last night! Longbraid would have my head if he knew that I passed out during my watch. The noggin hurts something fierce. Felt as though a whole brigade of siege engines passed overhead
column2: all that rumbling. Oh my
column3: look at the time! I promised Brewmeister Bilger in Southshore that I'd repay my debt to him by sending some Moonshine. But there are just 15 minutes left before I'm overdue! Take him this batch
column4: would you please? And hurry!

column1: Rescue OOX-17/TN!^48^All^Tanaris^Homing Robot OOX-17/TN^Oglethorpe Obnoticus^Find OOX-17/TN!^^An OOX of Your Own^Escort OOX-17/TN to safety
column2: then report to Oglethorpe Obnoticus in Booty Bay.^The gnome's voice crackles once again from the robot: "I need to move OOX-17/TN to an open
column3: safe place so it can begin a lengthy take-off procedure. It has built-in cloaking
column4: but I need time on my end to make it operational again. I need you to escort the robot from its current location to
column5: let's say
column6: near the Caverns of Time! That should be a perfect place
column7: and long enough
column8: to get things on line!" "Escort it safely and then come talk to me in Booty Bay! Oglethorpe Obnoticus - out!"

column1: Ripple Recovery^48^All^Orgrimmar^Dran Droffers^Malton Droffers^Ripple Recovery^^^Talk to Malton Droffers in Orgrimmar.^I've got some salvage work for you
column2: and if you're an aficionado of fine ripple like I am
column3: then you'll love this task. Ripple! It's a drink
column4: you dummy. An abandoned Horde outpost has a stash of Hinterlands Honey Ripple from when they were in business. You can't get fine ripple like that anymore! One of Malton's dummy associates knows the shot
column5: so you'll go out there and bring me a case of packaged ripple
column6: and two for my own collection! Talk to Malton
column7: he'll fill you in on the details.

column1: Ripple Recovery^48^All^Orgrimmar^Malton Droffers^Gilveradin Sunchaser^Ripple Recovery^^^Talk to Gilveradin Sunchaser; his camp is located in the Hinterlands.^The elf you will need to talk to is Gilveradin Sunchaser. He can name any wine
column2: vintage and all
column3: just by smell alone! He can package up the ripple we need
column4: so you'll need to talk with him. We need six bottles for packaging
column5: two for dad
column6: and how ever many he'll want... and believe me
column7: he'll want some. When you've packaged the ripple and got dad's two bottles
column8: come back here! Gilveradin's camp is near some high elf lodge in the Hinterlands
column9: and those high elves are not good. Trust me.

column1: Stones of Binding^38^All^Arathi Highlands^Iridescent Shards^Stone of Inner Binding^The Princess Trapped^^^Gather the Burning Key
column2: the Cresting Key and the Thundering Key from the Stone of West Binding
column3: the Stone of East Binding and the Stone of Outer Binding.^Four Stones of Binding are scattered throughout Arathi. These stones keep me pinned beneath the earth. To unlock them you must unlock the strongest: the Stone of Inner Binding. And to do that
column4: you must gather keys from the other three. These stones are watched by guardians
column5: but if you are clever
column6: or lucky
column7: you may find ways to banish them.

column1: Breaking the Keystone^42^All^Arathi Highlands^Stone of Inner Binding^Keystone^The Princess Trapped^^Myzrael's Allies
column2: Myzrael's Allies^Find and kill Fozruk. Bring the Rod of Order to the Keystone in the Arathi Highlands.^Opening the Stones of Binding loosened much of my confinement
column3: but a lock still holds me chained. It is the Keystone you see among this circle of stones. And the key is held by one of my captors
column4: the stone watcher Fozruk. You must obtain that key
column5: which the stone watchers call the Rod of Order
column6: from Fozruk and use it to open the Keystone. <name>
column7: you have done so much to aid me. Just a little more...and my gratitude will shake the very foundations of the earth!

column1: Myzrael's Allies^40^Alliance^Arathi Highlands^Keystone^Gerrig Bonegrip^Myzrael's Allies^Breaking the Keystone^Theldurin the Lost^Speak with Gerrig Bonegrip in the Forlorn Cavern of Ironforge.^<Myzrael speaks.> Free! I AM FREE! I am free to gather strength
column2: hidden from my captors. For if they faced me now they would surely overpower and again imprison me. But in time I will confront the giants
column3: and they will regret their wardship of me! You are a noble ally
column4: <name>. I will need your help again in time. When I am ready
column5: I will need you to summon me to the surface. Speak with Gerrig Bonegrip. He is in Ironforge
column6: in a shop of the Forlorn Cavern. He knows how I can be summoned.

column1: Tanaris Field Sampling^46^Horde^Tanaris^Model 4711-FTZ Power Source^Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle^Tanaris Field Sampling^Slake That Thirst^^Acquire untested samples for 8 basilisks
column2: 8 hyenas
column3: and 8 scorpions. Bring the testing kit back to Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle in Gadgetzan before the power source runs out.^Activating the power source makes the field testing kit start to glow and vibrate. It would seem to be working as planned. I will have it shipped immediately. According to Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle
column4: you now have some time to collect the data you need in the Tanaris desert. Return to him when you have completed the task.

column1: Hammerfall^34^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Gor'mul^Tor'gan^Hammerfall^^^Speak with Tor'gan in Hammerfall.^It is still clear to me
column2: like yesterday... So many years without hope
column3: with wood and steel to bind me to this terrible place. Then finally
column4: finally! There was the Warchief. Doomhammer in his midnight plate
column5: his warhammer held high. It was... too terrible... That the blow of a coward would strike down our greatest hero. From behind he charged on his horse
column6: and then his lance ran him through... I fell to my knees. What hope was there? What hope is there...

column1: Summoning the Princess^50^All^Arathi Highlands^Theldurin the Lost^Shards of Myzrael^^The Lost Fragments^^Go to the Shards of Myzrael
column2: summon her and defeat her.^You must defeat Myzrael before she grows in strength. If you do not
column3: then once she has gathered enough power she will challenge her captors! There are some who think they can control her
column4: but if she can be controlled then why did the giants chain her in the first place?? Crazy logic
column5: eh? To defeat her
column6: summon her at the Shards of Myzrael where you first spoke with her. Defeat her and gather her Eldritch Shackles
column7: then bind them to the Shards of Myzrael. Do that
column8: and she will again be trapped.

column1: Hints of a New Plague?^36^All^Hillsbrad Foothills^Quae^Kinelory^Hints of a New Plague?^^Hints of a New Plague?^Speak to Kinelory near Go'Shek Farm in Arathi Highlands.^<Quae begins to go through the folder.> This IS interesting. Seems Apothecary Jorell has been working on some deadly experiments here at Go'Shek. Not sure what that has to do with Hillsbrad
column2: but Phin wouldn't like it if we let it continue. We had a run-in with some orcs while you were gone
column3: and I'm not in good enough shape to help Kinelory. If you're up for it
column4: she's going to need some protection when she goes down to the farm to steal whatever research Jorell still hasn't sent to Tarren Mill.

column1: Hints of a New Plague?^36^All^Hillsbrad Foothills^Quae^Quae^Hints of a New Plague?^^^Find the Forsaken Courier and bring back her Sealed Folder to Quae near the Go'Shek Farm.^So
column2: Phin sent you to check on us? Not surprised--he worries too much. We've been watching the farm for days
column3: and Kin claims she saw a courier come out of that small house to the south not long ago. She talks a lot
column4: but I can always trust her senses when we're in dangerous areas. You wouldn't happen to be a skilled tracker
column5: would you? We think the courier might be carrying notes to Tarren Mill. If we could get our hands on those documents
column6: it might shed some light on what's happening in Hillsbrad.

column1: Hints of a New Plague?^33^Alliance^Hillsbrad Foothills^Phin Odelic^Quae^Hints of a New Plague?^^^Find Quae and Kinelory near the Go'Shek Farm in the Arathi Highlands.^Hail
column2: and well met
column3: <name>. I lead a group of adventurers investigating odd happenings in this area. My cousin in Hillsbrad recently put down his dog Stanley because the animal mystically grew to an immense size and savagely attacked anyone who came near him. I believe the undead are involved
column4: and we're looking for signs to prove as much. Two of my companions
column5: Quae and Kinelory
column6: headed to the Go'Shek Farm in the Arathi Highlands
column7: and haven't checked in for days. Find them for me? I grow concerned.

column1: Hints of a New Plague?^37^All^Hillsbrad Foothills^Kinelory^Quae^Hints of a New Plague?^Hints of a New Plague?^^Protect Kinelory until she returns to Quae.^All right
column2: <name>. I'm ready if you are. Shall we?

column1: Hints of a New Plague?^37^Alliance^Hillsbrad Foothills^Quae^Phin Odelic^Hints of a New Plague?^^^Find Phin Odelic at Southshore in Hillsbrad Foothills.^I've seen Kinelory look way worse after a night in the tavern than she does now. You obviously did a good job protecting her. These items she brought back from the farm should at least let Phin get an idea of what's going on out here in Arathi. Just to make sure there's no retaliation after your attack
column2: we're going to stay here for a bit longer. Would you be willing to head back to Southshore and talk to Phin?

column1: Deep Sea Salvage^40^All^Arathi Highlands^First Mate Nilzlix^First Mate Nilzlix^^Land Ho!^^First Mate Nilzlix wants you to retrieve the Charts and Logs from the Maiden's Folly and the Spirit of Silverpine.^O'Breen led the ships into the cove. We were certain this is where the treasure could be found. The Harbinger docked safely but as the Maiden's Folly and Spirit of Silverpine approached the tides began to lower. Strangest thing I've ever seen! Those two ships ran aground into something... some sort of temple in the reef. They sank so quickly
column2: was quite a tragedy. We need to retrieve their Logs as well as their Charts before we leave. We can't leave that information behind for prying eyes!

column1: Land Ho!^35^All^Arathi Highlands^Lolo the Lookout^Shakes O'Breen^^^Deep Sea Salvage
column2: Drowned Sorrows
column3: Sunken Treasure^Talk to Captain O'Breen at Faldir's Cove in Arathi Highlands.^Lolo sees a tiny <race>! Always on the lookout
column4: Lolo is! Welcome to Faldir's Cove. Captain O'Breen said we'd only be here for a few hours. Just long enough to gather the treasure and get back to Booty Bay. But Lolo thinks we're going to be here a lot longer than that. We lost the other two ships from our formation. Poor Spirit of Silverpine and Maiden's Folly. On the bottom of the sea they rest now! Lolo suggests you talk to Captain O'Breen if you plan on sticking around here.

column1: Drowned Sorrows^40^All^Arathi Highlands^Captain Steelgut^Captain Steelgut^^Land Ho!^^Captain Steelgut in Faldir's Cove wants you to kill 10 Daggerspine Raiders and 3 Daggerspine Sorceresses.^Argh
column2: 'tis a horrible life. I should be in a watery grave right now
column3: not sittin' here by the fire
column4: breathin' fresh air. The crew tried so hard to save my beautiful Maiden's Folly. Bless the boys
column5: bless their hearts. O'Breen made it to shore safely but we weren't so lucky. The seas just sank on us
column6: I swear. One second we're afloat and the next water is rushin' in. And those beasts! Killed all the survivors. Horrible naga scum. I went black and ended up here
column7: saved. I want those beasts dead.

column1: Sunken Treasure^40^All^Arathi Highlands^Professor Phizzlethorpe^Doctor Draxlegauge^Sunken Treasure^Land Ho!^^Escort Professor Phizzlethorpe to the cave and back.^Now that we are full-fledged Blackwater Raiders it is our job to help Mr. O'Breen locate the lost elven treasure. It is next to impossible to find the gems in the dark sea without aid. The doctor has constructed some goggles that will help. He needs the goggles charged with the energy derived from the enchanted stone in the cave just up the hill. But the cave is cursed! When we get close
column2: we get ambushed. Defend me and I can harness the energy from the stone into the goggles.

column1: Sunken Treasure^40^All^Arathi Highlands^Doctor Draxlegauge^Doctor Draxlegauge^Sunken Treasure^^^Doctor Draxlegauge in Faldir's Cove wants you to collect 10 Elven Gems and return the Goggles of Gem Hunting once you are done.^The treasure has been on the sea floor so long that the gems have calcified into thick stone. But the power harnessed in these goggles will allow you to locate them easily. A little gnomish ingenuity goes a long way! So borrow the Goggles of Gem Hunting
column2: <name>
column3: and see if you can collect some of the lost treasure for Captain O'Breen. I'd swim down there myself but...um...well
column4: I have important scientific business to tend to up on the safe
column5: dry land....er
column6: yeah.

column1: Death From Below^44^All^Arathi Highlands^Shakes O'Breen^Shakes O'Breen^^Sunken Treasure^^Protect Shakes O'Breen during the attack.^This is bad. It seems the Daggerspines are amassing for an attack. Naga are known for their ruthlessness in battle. They will keep attacking until I am dead. I don't value my own life above that of my crew members
column2: but you must help to defend me. The crew will not be able to make it back to Booty Bay without my knowledge of the seas. The naga will be coming from the sea. I need you to remain up here with me to fend off the attack. Man the cannon and drive them back. Are you ready
column3: <name>?

column1: Sunken Treasure^40^All^Arathi Highlands^Doctor Draxlegauge^Shakes O'Breen^Sunken Treasure^^^Take the Elven Gems to Captain O'Breen at Faldir's Cove in Arathi Highlands.^Let's not leave Captain O'Breen waiting. He'll want to see these gems first hand. After all
column2: that's why we're here! And after a few weeks of consorting with these pirates
column3: the professor and I have realized the last thing that's good for our health is to be caught hanging on to their treasure. Here
column4: <name>
column5: take these to O'Breen.

column1: Sunken Treasure^40^All^Arathi Highlands^Shakes O'Breen^Fleet Master Seahorn^Sunken Treasure^^^Take the Sample Elven Gem to Fleet Master Seahorn at Booty Bay in Stranglethorn Vale.^Fleet Master Seahorn will want to hear about our find at once. But as you can see
column2: we're not in much of a position to get out of here. Not only is the tide too low
column3: but those damned creatures we disrupted are keeping a close eye on our movements. You can be of great service to the Blackwater Raiders if you can get word to Fleet Master Seahorn in Booty Bay that we discovered the treasure and are working on extracting more. Take him this sample as proof.

column1: Sunken Treasure^40^All^Arathi Highlands^Fleet Master Seahorn^Shakes O'Breen^Sunken Treasure^^Death From Below^Deliver Seahorn's Letter to Shakes O'Breen at Faldir's Cove in Arathi Highlands.^Say
column2: <name>
column3: you seem to be an adventurous type. My fleet is stuck in Booty Bay until we can restock. There are some heavy things brewing here and abroad and I need to get some top secret correspondence to Shakes O'Breen who is tied up off the Arathi coast. Can I trust you to deliver this message safely and in confidence?

column1: Foul Magics^33^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Tor'gan^Tor'gan^^^Foul Magics^Get 10 Bloodstone Amulets for Tor'gan in Hammerfall.^I have felt a strangeness in the air... a feeling that simmers in my blood. I had my suspicions. I set off to find the source of my unease and discovered to the west
column2: at Northfold Manor
column3: the residual traces of demonic summoning. As I got close
column4: my blood began to boil and the rage within me grew. On the ground I spied an amulet of bloodstone
column5: used to assist in demonic summoning. The one I found was depleted
column6: however. I'll need another to examine
column7: but I dare not return to the manor. Can you bring me some?

column1: Raising Spirits^34^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Tor'gan^Tor'gan^Hammerfall^^^Acquire 10 Highland Raptor Eyes from Highland Striders and Highland Thrashers for Tor'gan in Hammerfall.^We tried to settle him in
column2: cheer him up
column3: telling him stories of our mighty city at Orgrimmar in Kalimdor
column4: but nothing would move him. Tales of our young Warchief
column5: Thrall
column6: who bears the armor and hammer of Orgrim... but
column7: perhaps... Perhaps! A demonstration of our newly found shamanistic magic would give him new hope. It is worth a try! A small object we could make for him
column8: yes... Bring me some raptor eyes
column9: and I will see what I can do.

column1: Foul Magics^40^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Tor'gan^Tor'gan^^Foul Magics^^Retrieve Marez Cowl's Bloodstone Orb and bring it to Tor'gan in Hammerfall.^There is no doubt in my mind that a powerful warlock resides within the walls of Stromgarde. From time to time
column2: using an arcane magical relic
column3: this warlock has summoned forth terrible demons in large numbers. We must remove the source of his energy. Find the warlock and kill him. Bring me whatever magical object you find on his person
column4: and I will take steps to destroy it and see that its power is not used to taint this land any longer.

column1: Raising Spirits^34^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Tor'gan^Gor'mul^Hammerfall^^^Give the Raptor Talon Amulet to Gor'mul at Hammerfall in Arathi Highlands.^Here
column2: take this amulet to Gor'mul
column3: and see if the raptors' strength can awaken the flame of the warrior that once burned through his veins.

column1: Raising Spirits^34^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Gor'mul^Tor'gan^Hammerfall^^^Speak with Tor'gan at Hammerfall in Arathi Highlands.^<Gor'mul tosses the amulet into the ground.> Tor'gan sent you
column2: didn't he? Pah! Why he feels some mercy towards me I would not understand. Mercy was denied me when I was not allowed to die with my Warchief in battle. A cruel blow fate has dealt me...

column1: The Hammer May Fall^32^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^Tallow^Drum Fel^The Hammer May Fall^^^Kill 8 Boulderfist Ogres and 10 Boulderfist Enforcers
column2: then find Drum Fel in the Hammerfall outpost in Arathi Highlands.^Weaklings... all of them. You
column3: <class>
column4: what are you looking at? Think you're something special
column5: huh? Why not prove it? The Hammerfall outpost in Arathi's under attack. Unless we send them help soon
column6: their demise is imminent. But before you go rushing off
column7: you may want to test your skills first. Northeast of Stromgarde in Arathi is an ogre mound inhabited by the Boulderfist tribe. When you can handle the ogres and enforcers there
column8: then report to Drum Fel in Hammerfall.

column1: Call to Arms^32^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Drum Fel^Drum Fel^The Hammer May Fall^^^Slay 10 Witherbark Axe Throwers
column2: 10 Headhunters and 8 Witch Doctors
column3: and return to Drum Fel in the Hammerfall outpost.^The Witherbark trolls and Boulderfist ogres of Arathi are working together to rid us from this land
column4: but we shall not meet our fates at their
column5: or anyone else's
column6: hand. We will slay them and show them that we
column7: too
column8: have a home here. The trolls turned their backs to us; the ogres would use us for food and bedding if we allowed them to--these things shall not be. We start our attack on the Witherbark trolls to the south of here. Slay them in droves
column9: and only return when their camps run thick with blood.

column1: Call to Arms^38^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Drum Fel^Drum Fel^The Hammer May Fall^^The Real Threat^Kill 10 Boulderfist Brutes and 4 Boulderfist Magi
column2: and return to Drum Fel in the Hammerfall outpost.^Your strength is evident
column3: <name>. Now to see how you fare against a real enemy. The Boulderfists have a lair to the southwest of here towards the dwarven bridge
column4: and
column5: if I'm not mistaken
column6: the maulers and magi there shall present to you a greater challenge--they have done so to us thus far. Slay as many as you can and come to me in body when you are successful
column7: or come to me in spirit when you fail. I shall give praise to your tenacity in battle either way.

column1: Call to Arms^40^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Drum Fel^Drum Fel^The Hammer May Fall^^^Kill 7 Boulderfist Shaman and 3 Boulderfist Lords and return to Drum Fel in the Hammerfall outpost.^The head of the beast is ready to be taken off... with great force
column2: <name>. You have shown every sign that you are able to help us with this final mighty blow. The leaders of these attacks have made their lair within the ruins of Stromgarde
column3: a glaring symbol of human frailty. Find and slay those Boulderfist lords and their lackey shaman who would try and drive us from these lands.

column1: The Real Threat^40^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Korin Fel^Korin Fel^^Call to Arms^^Slay Or'Kalar and bring his Head to Korin Fel in the Hammerfall outpost.^You serve my husband well
column2: <class>
column3: but he does not know why Hammerfall is under attack. Or'Kalar
column4: Mug'thol's pawn in Stromgarde
column5: has an intense hatred for my husband
column6: and wishes nothing more than my husband's death for defeating him years ago. My auguries tell me that Or'Kalar has laid a trap for my husband
column7: so I have hidden signs of the ogre's presence from him. My husband will rush off foolishly if he learns of the ogre's whereabouts and I would ask for your help in slaying the creature.

column1: Northfold Manor^31^All^Arathi Highlands^Captain Nials^Captain Nials^^^Stromgarde Badges^Kill 10 Syndicate Highwaymen and 6 Syndicate Mercenaries.^We are fighting a war for Stromgarde
column2: and we are losing. The ogres
column3: the Syndicate and we have divided our once great city
column4: and each faction battles the other into a bloody stalemate. But our forces dwindle while our enemy grows. We need help from the town of Southshore
column5: but supplies are difficult to receive while the Syndicate holds territory between us. Go to the Syndicate base in Northfold Manor and slay them. Then
column6: perhaps
column7: pressure on our supply trains will lessen and more will get through.

column1: Stromgarde Badges^37^Alliance^Arathi Highlands^Captain Nials^Captain Nials^^Northfold Manor^^Bring 7 Stromgarde Badges to Captain Nials at Refuge Pointe.^The Syndicate in Stromgarde do battle with our contingent of militia there. In order to urge the rabble to fight our more disciplined troops
column2: the Syndicate leaders have placed a bounty on our soldiers
column3: awarding gold for each Stromgarde Badge gathered off killed militiamen. We want those badges retrieved - we cannot allow the cutthroats to take trophies from our brave fallen! Enter the Syndicate-controlled area of Stromgarde and hunt them for our badges.

column1: Sara Balloo's Plea^30^Alliance^Ironforge^Sara Balloo^King Magni Bronzebeard^^Sully Balloo's Letter^A King's Tribute^Take Sara Balloo's note to King Magni Bronzebeard of Ironforge.^<name>
column2: I have but a small request to ask of you. Take this note I have prepared to our great monarch of Ironforge
column3: King Magni Bronzebeard. 'Tis a small task to ask of one such as yourself
column4: someone who has shown great valor to the cause of the Alliance thus far. For me to go before the King in my grief-ridden state would not serve the purpose of my cause. Surely you understand.

column1: Wanted! Marez Cowl^39^Alliance^Arathi Highlands^Wanted Board^Captain Nials^^^^Bring Marez's head to Captain Nials at Refuge Pointe.^A bounty has been placed on the head of Marez Cowl
column2: a high-level advisor and operative of the Syndicate. She was last seen within the Syndicate controlled territory of Stromgarde. Bounty may be collected from Captain Nials. Be warned: Marez is a skilled and cunning Warlock
column3: known for her trafficking with demons. Extreme caution is advised when hunting her.

column1: Wanted! Otto and Falconcrest^40^Alliance^Arathi Highlands^Wanted Board^Captain Nials^^^^Bring Otto's Head and Falconcrest's Head to Captain Nials at Refuge Pointe.^The Stromgarde Militia has placed bounties on the heads of Lord Falconcrest
column2: and his bodyguard Otto. Falconcrest heads the Syndicate's efforts in the Arathi Highlands
column3: and his death would cause a major disruption in those efforts. His bodyguard Otto
column4: although not a strategic target
column5: is a fierce opponent and has killed dozens of our defenders. Their bounties may be collected from Captain Nials.

column1: A King's Tribute^30^Alliance^Ironforge^King Magni Bronzebeard^Grand Mason Marblesten^A King's Tribute^Sara Balloo's Plea^^King Magni Bronzebeard wants you to speak with Grand Mason Marblesten.^I do not expect good dwarves like Mrs. Balloo to understand why the travesties of war must be endured for the greater good of our people. The loss of her husband
column2: and the loss of every dwarf that fights in the name of the Alliance
column3: weighs heavy on my soul. While I cannot bring her husband back from the Twisting Nether
column4: I can pay tribute to him. I am going to commission a memorial to Sully Balloo to be built by Grand Mason Marblesten. Send word to him now
column5: <class>. You shall be custodian of my bidding.

column1: Theldurin the Lost^40^All^Arathi Highlands^Gerrig Bonegrip^Theldurin the Lost^Myzrael's Allies^^^Find Theldurin the Lost.^Theldurin the Lost was once a member of our order
column2: the Twilight's Hammer. But he lost his mind and scorned our teachings. And before he fled from us
column3: he stole the scroll of Myzrael! We could not catch him
column4: but rumors say he hides in the Badlands
column5: gibbering and mad. To bring the Lady back to us
column6: you must find the scroll. And to do that
column7: you must find Theldurin.

column1: Myzrael's Allies^40^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Keystone^Zaruk^Myzrael's Allies^Breaking the Keystone^Theldurin the Lost^Speak with Zaruk at Hammerfall in Arathi Highlands.^<Myzrael speaks.> Free! I AM FREE! I am free to gather strength
column2: hidden from my captors. For if they faced me now they would surely overpower and again imprison me. But in time I will confront the giants
column3: and they will regret their wardship of me! You are a noble ally
column4: <name>. I will need your help again in time. When I am ready
column5: I will need you to summon me to the surface Speak with Zaruk in Hammerfall. He knows how I can be summoned.

column1: A King's Tribute^31^Alliance^Ironforge^Grand Mason Marblesten^Grand Mason Marblesten^A King's Tribute^^A King's Tribute^Grand Mason Marblesten of Ironforge wants 5 pieces of Alterac Granite.^So our good King would like a memorial built in honor of a soldier named Sully Balloo? And you say the poor chap died during the Thandol Span tragedy? Bah
column2: will there ever be peace on Azeroth? Nonetheless
column3: any commission from the King is of utmost importance. To build a truly epic and lasting piece I want to work with one of the finest stones available. Travel to Darrow Hill in Hillsbrad and gather for me some Alterac Granite.

column1: Malin's Request^32^Alliance^Stormwind City^Archmage Malin^Skuerto^^^Worth Its Weight in Gold^Find Skuerto at Refuge Pointe in the Arathi Highlands.^Greetings
column2: <name>. You have the look of an adventurer about you
column3: and I have a task that needs some tending to. Archmage Trelane
column4: my original master
column5: fled Stromgarde in the Arathi Highlands not too long ago
column6: and he's asked me to help him in recovering some of the items he left behind. The city fell under siege
column7: and he attempted to defend the Tower of Arathor
column8: but to no avail. I have agents in the Highlands already
column9: but they've requested I send more aid. Are you interested?

column1: Worth Its Weight in Gold^36^Alliance^Arathi Highlands^Apprentice Kryten^Apprentice Kryten^^Malin's Request^Wand over Fist^Find 10 Witherbark Tusks
column2: 4 Witherbark Medicine Pouches and a Shadow Hunter Knife for Apprentice Kryten at Refuge Pointe.^Archmage Malin sent Skuerto and I here to collect reagents for him. I was at a loss as to how I was going to collect the items
column3: but now that you're here
column4: I think my problem's solved. I need the following: Witherbark tusks
column5: Witherbark medicine pouches and a shadow hunter knife. Could you find those for me? The Witherbark live to the southeast of Arathi.

column1: The Lost Fragments^41^All^Badlands^Theldurin the Lost^Theldurin the Lost^Myzrael's Allies^^Summoning the Princess^Bring the Torn Scroll Fragment
column2: the Crumpled Scroll Fragment and the Singed Scroll Fragment to Theldurin the Lost.^The Scroll of Myzrael...the Scroll of Myzrael?! You don't want that! Its magic can pull Myzrael to the surface world and if you do that
column3: we are in trouble! Or...maybe it's too late. Maybe she already is free. Maybe she's just gathering strength before unleashing herself upon us. If so
column4: then you'll NEED the scroll! ...too bad it's destroyed. Enraged elementals stole it and tore it up and now fight over the fragments. But if you can gather those fragments
column5: maybe we can fix it...

column1: Wand over Fist^39^Alliance^Arathi Highlands^Skuerto^Skuerto^^Worth Its Weight in Gold^Trelane's Defenses^Find Trelane's Wand of Invocation and return it to Skuerto at Refuge Pointe.^Hey
column2: <name>. Sorry to be so short with ye earlier... and no
column3: that ain't a pun. I figured out where Trelane's first item ended up: Kor'gresh has it in Boulderfist Hall. An' by the way he was throwing down blasts of ice at his kin to keep them in line
column4: he must be close to figurin' out how to use all of its powers. Boulderfist Hall's south of here an' then east of Thandol Span. Find the ogre an' get back that wand. While you're gone
column5: I'll figure out what we're gonna do about Stromgarde.

column1: Trelane's Defenses^39^Alliance^Arathi Highlands^Skuerto^Apprentice Kryten^Trelane's Defenses^Wand over Fist^^Find an Azure Agate and bring it to Apprentice Kryten at Refuge Pointe.^All rested? Here's our next step: there're ogres all around the Tower of Arathor in Stromgarde. We're gonna need to activate the tower's defenses if you're gonna stand a chance against 'em an' still make it to the items alive. To do that
column2: we're gonna need some gems the Boulderfist shaman have taken a liking to. They took 'em from the tower
column3: but they're not gonna stay in their possession for long. Get one of them gems an' bring 'em to Kryten--he knows the spell to enchant 'em so they'll work as a key.

column1: An Apprentice's Enchantment^39^Alliance^Arathi Highlands^Apprentice Kryten^Skuerto^Trelane's Defenses^^^Speak to Skuerto at Refuge Pointe in Arathi Highlands.^Here you are
column2: <name>. The gem only needs to be pressed against one of the pedestals near the base of the tower to activate its defenses. Use it when you're ready to enter the tower and find Trelane's remaining items. Good luck to you. I'll be awaiting your return here at the camp. Oh
column3: and speak to Skuerto before you leave. He'll give you the rest of the details you'll need.

column1: Attack on the Tower^39^Alliance^Arathi Highlands^Skuerto^Skuerto^Trelane's Defenses^^^Find Trelane's Phylactery
column2: Trelane's Orb
column3: and Trelane's Ember Agate
column4: and return them to Skuerto at Refuge Pointe.^Here's what your lookin' for: Trelane's phylactery
column5: Trelane's orb
column6: an' Trelane's ember agate. All three should be in chests within the tower an' you shouldn't have a problem opening the chests on your own; you just have to be careful of the ogres. The tower's defenses won't take care of 'em on their own; you'll need to have your weapons at the ready. Those ogres find out you're there and stealing from 'em
column7: an' they'll be sure to put the hurt on you. Be careful
column8: an' good luck.

column1: Malin's Request^39^Alliance^Arathi Highlands^Skuerto^Archmage Malin^Trelane's Defenses^^^Take the Sealed Letter to Archmage Malin in the Mage Quarter of Stormwind.^Take this letter back to Stormwind and let Malin know that Kryten an' I'll be home soon. He'll reward you well for helping us here
column2: <name>
column3: of that I've no doubt. Travel safely.

column1: Lack of Surplus^40^Horde^Swamp of Sorrows^Dar^Tok'Kar^Lack of Surplus^^^Bring 8 Unprepared Sawtooth Flanks to Tok'Kar in Swamp of Sorrows.^I'm working on getting some supplies together for our outpost near the beach to the east--Tok'kar does what he can
column2: but between shifts of guard duty and cooking for his soldiers there's not much time left in the day. They do enjoy cooking up some sawtooth meat when they can
column3: but I haven't had time to get them another shipment. Would you mind helping them out? The young sawtooths aren't as tasty as the older ones
column4: so stay clear of those; give them a year or two to get to full size.

column1: Lack of Surplus^42^Horde^Swamp of Sorrows^Tok'Kar^Tok'Kar^Lack of Surplus^^^Bring 6 Sawtooth Snapper Claws to Tok'Kar in the Swamp of Sorrows.^With the threat of murlocs along the coast
column2: we're stationed out here to protect--or warn if the force is too large--of any coming threats to Stonard. It doesn't give us much time for relaxation
column3: and we could use some more help if you're able. The sawtooth snappers' claws make for fine weapons when properly prepared. Bring me some of their claws and I'll see you're rewarded with one of our weapons in thanks for the fresh meat and the good company.

column1: A King's Tribute^31^Alliance^Ironforge^Grand Mason Marblesten^King Magni Bronzebeard^^A King's Tribute^^Report to King Magni Bronzebeard.^Ah
column2: such fine stone comes from Lordaeron. Such a shame the land is in such shambles. But the Memorial came out quite well! I should think the King will be most pleased with it. Now if you will
column3: please send word to His Majesty that the Memorial is complete as requested.

column1: Guile of the Raptor^37^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Tor'gan^Tor'gan^Hammerfall^^^Acquire 12 Raptor Hearts from Highland Fleshstalkers for Tor'gan.^With some additional objects
column2: I will be able to create an item that will imbue Gor'mul with the guile of the raptor! With the power of the raptor flowing through him
column3: Gor'mul will know our new power and rediscover the warrior that lies dormant! I will require raptor hearts to fashion the item and spell.

column1: Guile of the Raptor^37^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Tor'gan^Gor'mul^Hammerfall^^Guile of the Raptor^Give Tor'gan's Orb to Gor'mul at Hammerfall in Arathi Highlands.^Take this orb and use its energy to give Gor'mul the essence of the raptor. Surely this will invigorate his spirit and give him new purpose in life. With him returned to normal
column2: we can explain to him the current state of the Horde
column3: and we will have a great warrior's assistance in our unceasing battles.

column1: Barbecued Buzzard Wings^40^All^Badlands^Rigglefuzz^Rigglefuzz^^^^Bring 4 Buzzard Wings to Rigglefuzz.^Oh yes
column2: my barbecued buzzard wings are a favorite! The sauce is rich and the meat is tangy. And the smell will bring the hungry running from miles away! I have everything I need to cook up a batch. Everything...except the buzzard wings! If you want some then get me the buzzard wings. Bring me enough
column3: and I might even share the recipe with you!

column1: Agmond's Fate^38^Alliance^Loch Modan^Prospector Ironband^Prospector Ironband^Ironband Wants You!^^^Bring 4 Carved Stone Urns to Prospector Ironband in Loch Modan.^The last report I received from Agmond is troubling
column2: more so now that he's dead! He mentioned that his diggers uncovered "ancient urns" at the dig site outside Uldaman. I fear that the urns he found at that site incited the troggs
column3: just as did the idols I found here. I need you to get those urns for our studies. Go to the Uldaman site
column4: gather the urns
column5: then return to me.

column1: Pearl Diving^37^All^Badlands^Rigglefuzz^Rigglefuzz^^^^Bring 9 Blue Pearls to Rigglefuzz in the Badlands.^The Badlands is a harsh place
column2: filled with vicious predators and bold scavengers. Scary
column3: especially for a short little goblin. To survive
column4: I have to be tricky! I know the recipe for flash bombs. I use those to scare away wildlife. But I'm running low on one of the ingredients: crushed blue pearl powder. Get me some and I'll make it worth your efforts. Heh
column5: and I hope you have good boots on. The Blue Pearls I need are found from clams at the Vile Reef. Yep
column6: the Vile Reef in Stranglethorn!

column1: Fiery Blaze Enchantments^45^Alliance^Badlands^Sigrun Ironhew^Sigrun Ironhew^^^^Acquire a Black Drake's Heart for Sigrun Ironhew.^As an apprentice to Feranor Steeltoe
column2: I learned his special technique for imbuing weapons with fiery enchantments. Last I heard of him
column3: he was working at a smithy with a hunting party up in Lordaeron. I can't tell you too many of the details about the process
column4: but I can tell you it requires blood from a rare
column5: still-beating black drake whelp's heart. I don't have much to do waiting for word from Ironforge. If you bring me a heart from the whelps in Lethlor Ravine
column6: I'll show you my skill!

column1: Ironband Wants You!^37^Alliance^Ironforge^Prospector Stormpike^Prospector Ironband^Ironband Wants You!^^^Speak with Prospector Ironband at Ironband's Excavation Site in Loch Modan.^<name>. I received reports from Prospector Ironband at his excavation site in Loch Modan--he needs some legwork done concerning another of our excavations. I don't have more details than that
column2: but if you want to stretch your legs then go speak with Ironband.

column1: The Black Box^40^Alliance^Badlands^Corroded Black Box^Pilot Longbeard^^^^Take the Corroded Black Box to the Hall of Arms in Ironforge.^The surface of this metallic black box is heavily pitted
column2: as if it had been immersed in acid - it must have been sitting in the giant condor's stomach for a long time. Turning the box over
column3: a symbol is found stamped on its bottom. Below the symbol are the words: "Engine #19 - Ironforge Siege Brigade"

column1: Solution to Doom^40^All^Badlands^Theldurin the Lost^Theldurin the Lost^^^To Ironforge for Yagyin's Digest
column2: To the Undercity for Yagyin's Digest^Bring the Tablet of Ryun'eh to Theldurin the Lost.^Oh my! Oh my! There is a doom approaching. Mark me! A doom! No
column3: I cannot speak of it...cannot utter their names or they may hear me! But if we learn
column4: yes
column5: if we learn more of them...then maybe we can learn how to foil them! Maybe. Go into Uldaman. No! I said it! You must find...find the tablet of...Ryun'eh. Yes
column6: find it! And don't make me speak that name again! It is deep in that place
column7: in an ancient chest. That's where it hides...in a chest crafted before the works of any dwarf.

column1: Study of the Elements: Rock^37^All^Badlands^Lotwil Veriatus^Lotwil Veriatus^Study of the Elements: Rock^^^Find 10 Small Stone Shards and bring them to Lotwil Veriatus in the Badlands.^Here in the Badlands I've stopped to work on my latest project: my shackles of elemental binding. When complete
column2: they will allow mages to summon even more powerful elementals for use in even greater capacities. To start things off
column3: I need small stone shards to test some of my newest offensive spells along with a few gizmos I've pieced together. The shards are easily collected from the lesser rock elementals to the west of here. Could you bring me some?

column1: Study of the Elements: Rock^39^All^Badlands^Lotwil Veriatus^Lotwil Veriatus^Study of the Elements: Rock^^^Bring 3 Large Stone Slabs to Lotwil Veriatus in the Badlands.^<name>
column2: you've already proven more able than all my apprentices combined. The next parts I need require a little more strength. Large stone slabs can be found on rock elementals if you're careful enough. Their bodies are stronger and larger
column3: and therefore more prone to having pieces large enough for my tests. You can find them further west of here or southeast along the mountains' edges. Take your time; I'll need a while to test these smaller pieces you brought me.

column1: Study of the Elements: Rock^42^All^Badlands^Lotwil Veriatus^Lotwil Veriatus^Study of the Elements: Rock^^Stone Is Better than Cloth
column2: This Is Going to Be Hard^Bring 5 Bracers of Rock Binding to Lotwil Veriatus in the Badlands.^<name>
column3: there's one more part I need from the elementals here in the Badlands: the bracers of rock binding from the greater rock elementals. By my calculations
column4: those bracers should be enough to gauge the strength of my own shackles. My attempts at scrying the greater rock elementals showed a group of them southwest of here
column5: near some ogres if I recall. Bring me 5 of their bracers just so I have extras. Servo's notorious for misplacing my reagents and research.

column1: Coolant Heads Prevail^37^All^Badlands^Lotwil Veriatus^Lotwil Veriatus^Coolant Heads Prevail^^^Find Frost Oil and bring it to Lotwil Veriatus in Badlands.^Let me tell you something about Frost Oil: nothing can keep an engine or gears from overheating quite like it. Its cooling properties are extraordinary
column2: and its longevity as a lubricant without equal. That's not all: it also aids in retaining enchantments on magical items. I need a vial of it to increase the magical capacity of my shackles and make them powerful enough to stop our summoned friend from killing us all. Bro'kin
column3: a goblin friend of mine
column4: can teach you to make it. He's in Alterac.

column1: Gyro... What?^37^All^Badlands^Lotwil Veriatus^Lotwil Veriatus^Coolant Heads Prevail^^Liquid Stone
column2: This Is Going to Be Hard^Bring a Gyrochronatom to Lotwil Veriatus in the Badlands.^<name>
column3: you've done your job well beyond all standards. <Lotwil's obviously distracted by his work.> If we ever meet in Kharanos
column4: feel free to come apply for work. Whoops! Quick
column5: grab the... yes
column6: that. Thanks. Now I just need one more thing. It's a small part
column7: but rather crucial
column8: I'm afraid: a gyrochronatom. If you could just go grab one and bring it to me
column9: I should be ready to complete this.

column1: Liquid Stone^37^All^Badlands^Lucien Tosselwrench^Lucien Tosselwrench^^Gyro... What?^^Bring a Healing Potion and a Lesser Invisibility Potion to Lucien Tosselwrench in the Badlands.^I'm thinking those items you acquired for Lotwil are going to be the least of our worries
column2: <name>. On the other hand
column3: you've proven more than adept at the sciences Lotwil holds sacred
column4: so how about helping me out? I need an invisibility potion and a healing potion; both might come in handy real soon if he pulls this off. In return
column5: I'll give you this recipe for a potion I've been developing while learning from Lotwil. It's based on some of the research he's been doing here in the Badlands.

column1: Stone Is Better than Cloth^42^All^Badlands^Lucien Tosselwrench^Lucien Tosselwrench^^Study of the Elements: Rock^^Bring some Patterned Bronze Bracers to Lucien Tosselwrench in the Badlands.^I know how cheap Lotwil can be
column2: <name>
column3: so let me make you something for all your troubles. Maybe it'll even help protect you from the coming atrocity that is Lotwil's newest invention. I've been working with all the extra stones you collected for him
column4: and I can make some nice bracers that you might want to use. They're enchanted
column5: of course. I'll just need patterned bronze bracers crafted by a blacksmith so I can complete the bracers I'm making for you.

column1: Tremors of the Earth^50^Alliance^Badlands^Garek^Garek^Tremors of the Earth^^^Use the Sign of the Earth to activate the Pillars of Amethyst
column2: Opal
column3: and Diamond and obtain the Runestones.^It has become obvious that we cannot ensure that Blacklash and Hematus will remain imprisoned in Lethlor. That black dragons have taken up residence there
column4: and that the ogres managed to steal the Sign indicates that more drastic measures will have to be taken. The drakes' prison is maintained by three runestones that may only be retrieved using the Sign of the Earth. Those runestones can then be used to break the seal which imprisons them. <name>... assure that their dreams are eternal.

column1: Mirages^38^Alliance^Badlands^Sigrun Ironhew^Sigrun Ironhew^Mirages^^Tremors of the Earth^Retrieve the Supply Crate for Sigrun Ironhew.^In our hurry to leave the Uldaman excavation site
column2: we were forced to abandon many wagons and crates of supplies along the way. The local ogres from Camp Kosh have been on our abandoned equipment like vultures on a rotting corpse. Don't smell much better
column3: either. Than the corpses
column4: I mean. Anyways
