column5: they took the cart that was carrying all our weapons and such... so--well
column6: this is a bit embarrassing--we haven't been able to get any food. We're in a bit of a pickle here
column7: suppose you could help us out?

column1: A Dwarf and His Tools^35^Alliance^Badlands^Prospector Ryedol^Prospector Ryedol^^^^Find Ryedol's Lucky Pick and return it to Prospector Ryedol south of Hammertoe's Dig Site.^Hey
column2: <name>. Be careful 'round here. There be Dark Iron dwarves all around--looked like the Shadowforge clan. They just attacked the excavation site I was workin' at--killed nearly everyone there
column3: including my boss Hammertoe. I barely escaped with me life. The site's just to the north of here
column4: and I'm tryin' to plan a way to get some of our supplies back
column5: especially me lucky pick. Think you'd be up to helpin' me out some? One of those damned Dark Iron must have my pick! Could be anyone of them.

column1: A Sign of Hope^35^Alliance^Badlands^Crumpled Map^Prospector Ryedol^A Sign of Hope^^^Find Prospector Ryedol and let him know Hammertoe Grez is alive.^<There is text roughly scribbled in chalk on the map.> "Ryedol
column2: They're taking me to Uldaman. Send help.-Hammertoe"

column1: A Sign of Hope^35^Alliance^Loch Modan^Prospector Ryedol^Hammertoe Grez^A Sign of Hope^^^Find Hammertoe Grez in Uldaman.^<name>
column2: can ye find him? Can you find Hammertoe in Uldaman? If those dirty Shadowforge are holdin' him hostage to figure out what he knows about the titan excavations
column3: then all of Ironforge could be in huge trouble. For a long time now those Dark Irons have been lookin' for magics to make more powerful golems. Hammertoe was doin' the same
column4: of course
column5: but only to stop them. They're probably keepin' him alive until they learn what he knows.Ye've got to hurry if you're gonna save him!

column1: Amulet of Secrets^40^Alliance^Loch Modan^Hammertoe Grez^Hammertoe Grez^A Sign of Hope^^^Find Hammertoe's Amulet and return it to him in Uldaman.^Ye're brave... ... to come into Uldaman fer me
column2: <class>. If ye're really here to help... ol' Hammertoe
column3: then... ... you'll need to find... me amulet. Deepshadow's got it... Magregan Deepshadow. He's 'round here... in the ruins fer sure. That amulet'll lead 'em... ... right to the scrolls if he ain't stopped. It's up to you
column4: <name>. Please... get that amulet. The scrolls will surely help the Dark Irons create even more powerful golems. I just know it. I can feel it in me bones.

column1: Prospect of Faith^40^Alliance^Badlands^Hammertoe Grez^Prospector Ryedol^A Sign of Hope^^^Take Hammertoe's Amulet to Prospector Ryedol in the Badlands.^<Hammertoe holds his wounds and takes a moment to regain his composure before speaking again.> Find Ryedol
column2: <name>. Bring 'im me amulet. <cough cough> He'll... figure out what to do. He knows I was seeking the origins of our people
column3: and he... ... knows it was also my mission to stop the Shadowforge clan. They must not be allowed to find the scrolls...

column1: Prospect of Faith^40^Alliance^Badlands^Prospector Ryedol^Historian Karnik^A Sign of Hope^^Passing Word of a Threat^Take Hammertoe's Amulet to Historian Karnik in Ironforge.^Okay
column2: okay... who would know what to do? Historian Karnik! That's it! He's in Ironforge. He'll be able to help. He and Hammertoe were workin' together to find the lost artifacts in Uldaman. Guess the Shadowforge found out the two of them knew more than they were lettin' on. Tell Karnik what's happened to Hammertoe and give him the amulet--he'll tell you what needs to be done next.

column1: Passing Word of a Threat^40^Alliance^Badlands^Historian Karnik^Advisor Belgrum^Passing Word of a Threat^Prospect of Faith^^Find Advisor Belgrum and give him his note.^<name>
column2: run and find Advisor Belgrum as quickly as you can. Tell him what you've witnessed and ask him how he wants us to proceed. This note will explain more to him. In the meantime
column3: I will take the time to speak to Hammertoe's spirit. Maybe he knows something that will help us put a stop to those Shadowforge cretins' activities in the Badlands. We can only pray.

column1: Passing Word of a Threat^40^Alliance^Badlands^Advisor Belgrum^Historian Karnik^Passing Word of a Threat^^^Speak to Historian Karnik.^<Advisor Belgrum reaches the end of the note
column2: and his eyes widen for a moment.> Och
column3: these are evil tidings. <name>
column4: please return to Historian Karnik and tell him on the king's authority to act on this information swiftly and decisively. He must halt the Shadowforge's activities in the Badlands.

column1: To Ironforge for Yagyin's Digest^40^Alliance^Badlands^Theldurin the Lost^Gerrig Bonegrip^To Ironforge for Yagyin's Digest^Solution to Doom^^Give the Sigil of the Hammer to Gerrig Bonegrip in the Forlorn Cavern of Ironforge.^The Tablet tells much. But not enough! Not nearly enough! There is a book
column2: a digest that Yagyin wrote in ages past. The ... people I fled ... they keep this book in many places. And their most learned study it. It holds vast knowledge. Knowledge to protect us! Go to Gerrig Bonegrip. He is in a shop in Ironforge
column3: in the Forlorn Cavern. Show him this sigil and he'll think you one of them. Ask him for Yagyin's Digest ... and bring it to me!

column1: To the Undercity for Yagyin's Digest^40^Horde^Badlands^Theldurin the Lost^Keeper Bel'dugur^To the Undercity for Yagyin's Digest^Solution to Doom^^Bring the Sigil of the Hammer to Keeper Bel'dugur in the Undercity.^The tablet tells much. But not enough! Not nearly enough! There is a book
column2: a digest that Yagyin wrote in ages past. The... people I fled from... they keep this book in many places. And their most learned study it. It holds vast knowledge. Knowledge to protect us! Go to Keeper Bel'dugur in the Undercity of Lordaeron. Show him this sigil and he'll think you one of them. Ask him for Yagin's Digest...and bring it to me!

column1: The Absent Minded Prospector^20^All^Darkshore^Archaeologist Hollee^Prospector Remtravel^Trouble In Darkshore?^^The Absent Minded Prospector^Travel south and check on Prospector Remtravel.^What an honor it was when Master Greywhisker assigned me to work under the guidance of the great Prospector Remtravel. At the academy in Ironforge everyone knew of Remtravel's great discoveries. But the prospector is rather... um... oblivious ...to his surroundings. We had uncovered evidence of a great society. Horrible golems sprang forth from the ground and overran the site. Remtravel never seemed to notice. I ran back to Auberdine for help. Please travel south and see if the prospector is okay!

Trouble In Darkshore?^14^All^Darnassus^Chief Archaeologist Greywhisker^Archaeologist Hollee^Trouble In Darkshore?^^^Travel to Auberdine and look for signs of the dwarven excavation team.^How nice it is to see a <class> interested in the great archeological wonders of our world. Oftentimes our work is dismissed as mere hobby by our friends in the Alliance. But what many fail to realize is that recent discoveries in Khaz Modan have proven that a great and powerful force threatens all of Azeroth
column2: from Lordaeron to Kalimdor. I am most worried about my crew that I sent to Darkshore. They haven't sent word in weeks. Travel to Auberdine and look for a clue as to their whereabouts.

column1: The Absent Minded Prospector^20^All^Darkshore^Prospector Remtravel^Archaeologist Hollee^The Absent Minded Prospector^The Absent Minded Prospector^^Protect Prospector Remtravel as he searches for the mysterious fossil
column2: then return to Archaeologist Hollee in Auberdine.^So then
column3: Hollee... oh that's right
column4: you are not Hollee. Where's Hollee? Bah
column5: that's beside the point. We must find that stone brush... I mean the mysterious fossil! We must find that fossil. The Explorers' League in Darnassus will want some indication as to what I've been doing. Let me know when you are ready and we will hunt down that brush.... I mean fossil! We shall find something in writing to satisfy the League. So are you ready yet?

column1: Tremors of the Earth^43^Alliance^Badlands^Garek^Garek^Tremors of the Earth^Mirages^^Retrieve the Sign of the Earth for Garek.^I heard from Sigrun that you have been a great help to him. Perhaps I might enlist your help. I was sent here by my master
column2: Krasus of the Kirin Tor
column3: to put an end to the trouble brewing in Lethlor Ravine. I cannot divulge the exact nature of my assignment here or the tasks that I must undertake
column4: but be assured it is of vital importance. A band of wandering ogres
column5: sometimes seen near Camp Boff
column6: stole an object called the Sign of the Earth; I must have it. Bring it to me
column7: and I will tell you more.

column1: Scrounging^40^Alliance^Badlands^Sigrun Ironhew^Sigrun Ironhew^Mirages^^^Get 7 pieces of Scrap Metal for Sigrun.^It's going to be tough going here if I can't manage to scrounge up some materials to construct some defenses and other necessities. I've noticed that the ogres in the area seem to be well equipped with scrap metal. Maybe the stories of siege engines in the Badlands weren't so far off after all... Anyways
column2: the Prospector's been getting worried about the state of our little camp
column3: so I'd like to get working soon if I can. The main ogre camp is at Dustbelch Grotto
column4: a good trek to the west of here.

column1: This Is Going to Be Hard^42^All^Badlands^Lotwil Veriatus^Lucien Tosselwrench^This Is Going to Be Hard^Study of the Elements: Rock
column2: Gyro... What?^^Speak to Lucien Tosselwrench in the Badlands.^Wonderful
column3: wonderful. <Lotwil looks up at you for a moment before going back to his shackles.> Go speak to Lucien
column4: <name>. I need a cog #5. Bring it to me
column5: will you?

column1: The Star
column2: the Hand and the Heart^44^Alliance^Badlands^Gerrig Bonegrip^Gerrig Bonegrip^To Ironforge for Yagyin's Digest^^Forbidden Knowledge^Return the items on the Bonegrip's Note to Gerrig Bonegrip in Ironforge.^Yagyin's Digest
column3: eh? Are you starting a new chapter of us
column4: somewhere? Never mind
column5: it is not my place to ask. I will help you
column6: for I have an extra copy. We must aid each other
column7: yes? That is how we flourish. I require three items of power. Bring them to me and I will give you the digest. I will not speak their names. Ears may be on us. But here
column8: I will write them down.

column1: The Star
column2: the Hand and the Heart^44^Horde^Undercity^Keeper Bel'dugur^Keeper Bel'dugur^To the Undercity for Yagyin's Digest^^Forbidden Knowledge^Bring the items on Bel'dugur's Note to Keeper Bel'dugur in the Undercity.^You need Yagyin's Digest? Your plan
column3: then
column4: is to gather another flock? Of course it is...and of course I will help you
column5: <brother/sister>. But you must help me too. I require three items of power. Bring me these and the digest will be yours. I cannot utter the names of these items
column6: but I will write them down. Get me the items on this list. If you can do that
column7: then you are truly worthy of opening your own chapter of our order.

column1: Forbidden Knowledge^40^All^Badlands^Gerrig Bonegrip^Theldurin the Lost^To Ironforge for Yagyin's Digest^^^Bring Yagyin's Digest to Theldurin.^I have the digest for you
column2: <name>. I need not tell you to take great care with it. And to keep it far from unfriendly hands. This book holds many truths... ...And the truth can burn.

column1: Find Agmond^38^Alliance^Badlands^Prospector Ironband^Battered Dwarven Skeleton^Ironband Wants You!^^^Find Agmond.^Prospector Agmond was in charge of our excavation sites in the Badlands
column2: to the southwest. I say "was" because...well
column3: I haven't heard from him in weeks. I need you to find Agmond so I can get his report. Last I heard Agmond was at the southernmost dig site in the Badlands--a tiny operation past the Angor Fortress. I'd start your search for him there.

column1: Murdaloc^42^Alliance^Badlands^Battered Dwarven Skeleton^Prospector Ironband^Ironband Wants You!^^^Slay Agmond's killer
column2: Murdaloc.^Agmond's tracks lead from the west. It is easy to tell from the bloody smears across rock and sand that the dwarf crawled some distance. And here he died. Upon close inspection
column3: the word "Murdaloc" is roughly scrawled in a patch of Badlands sandstone. Scrawled next to Agmond's dead hand.

column1: The Absent Minded Prospector^20^All^Darkshore^Archaeologist Hollee^Chief Archaeologist Greywhisker^The Absent Minded Prospector^^^Take the mysterious fossil to Chief Archaeologist Greywhisker in Darnassus.^So the prospector wants to send the mysterious fossil to the Explorers' League in Darnassus? I don't feel right leaving Darkshore without him. Here
column2: <name>
column3: deliver the mysterious fossil to Chief Archaeologist Greywhisker in Darnassus.

column1: The Ashenvale Hunt^20^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Bluff Runner Windstrider^Senani Thunderheart^^^^Speak with Senani Thunderheart at Splintertree Post
column2: Ashenvale.^Attention
column3: young adventurers! The wilds of Ashenvale await you! The Horde has established a strong presence in the lands north of the Barrens. Our two outposts - Splintertree Post and the Zoram Strand Outpost - strive to bring glory to the Horde! Those who would prove themselves should seek out guidance there. Of note: Senani Thunderheart in Splintertree Post
column4: directly north of the Barrens
column5: seeks adventurers willing to take part in a great hunt of Ashenvale!

column1: Dangers of the Windfury^8^All^Mulgore^Ruul Eagletalon^Ruul Eagletalon^^^^Bring 8 Windfury Talons to Ruul Eagletalon in Bloodhoof Village.^Thank you for taking the time to speak to me
column2: <name>. I am Ruul
column3: warrior and teacher. You have obviously reached an age when you must prepare for your trials if you are to adventure much further out of Mulgore. If you wish a test of your strength
column4: start by seeking out the Windfury harpies to the southeast. They nestle along the mountain's edges away from the road. They are one of our natural enemies here in Mulgore and will be a good gauge of your skill.

column1: Preparation for Ceremony^11^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Eyahn Eagletalon^Eyahn Eagletalon^^^^Collect 6 Azure Feathers and 6 Bronze Feathers
column2: and bring them to Eyahn Eagletalon in Thunder Bluff.^<name>
column3: my brother soon stands before Chief Bloodhoof
column4: and it is my honor to make his headdress for him. I want to ask a favor of you while I finish tanning these leather straps. There is not time for me to find enough feathers
column5: and I was wondering
column6: would you gather more for me? You can find feathers of the correct size from the harpies residing far to the north and northwest of Thunder Bluff. I need only 6 azure and 6 bronze feathers to complete the design.

column1: Sharing the Land^6^All^Mulgore^Baine Bloodhoof^Baine Bloodhoof^^^^Kill 10 Palemane Tanners
column2: 8 Palemane Skinners
column3: and 5 Palemane Poachers
column4: then return to Baine Bloodhoof in Bloodhoof Village.^<name>
column5: there are many conflicts that wound this land. It is my hope that you will not bear witness to as many of them as I have. Yet there is one that I would ask you to seek out. It will give you some sense of how terrible
column6: if left unchecked
column7: even a small threat can be to the land. Palemane gnolls have settled to the south of Bloodhoof and in a cave to the west. They disrespect our attempts to communicate with them
column8: and they slay the wildlife of Mulgore unbridled. Words are no longer the answer.

column1: Dwarven Digging^8^All^Mulgore^Baine Bloodhoof^Baine Bloodhoof^^^^Collect 5 Prospector's Picks.^There are dwarves preparing a dig site to the northwest. They think secrets lie in the earth
column2: and that is true
column3: but hollowing and defiling the land is no way to earn its teachings. Collect the dwarven tools of digging
column4: smash them
column5: and return to me with the dwarves' broken tools. You can smash the tools at a forge. You will find one in Thunder Bluff
column6: but any forge -- even a forge at the dwarven camp -- will suffice.

column1: The Hunt Begins^2^Horde^Mulgore^Grull Hawkwind^Grull Hawkwind^^^The Hunt Continues
column2: Simple Note
column3: Etched Note
column4: Rune-Inscribed Note
column5: Verdant Note^Grull Hawkwind in Camp Narache wants you to bring him 7 Plainstrider Feathers and 7 pieces of Plainstrider Meat.^You have a promising air about you
column6: and will prove yourself to the tribe. Perhaps someday soon you will be welcomed into the great city of Thunder Bluff. But before that can happen you must prove yourself to my father
column7: Chief Hawkwind. Up here on Red Cloud Mesa we pride ourselves on keen hunting skills. Tauren hunt out of necessity and for sport. Our supply of meats has run low and we require feathers for clothing. Hunt the nearby plainstriders and prove yourself by resupplying the village.

column1: Poison Water^5^Tauren^Mulgore^Mull Thunderhorn^Mull Thunderhorn^^^Winterhoof Cleansing^Bring 6 Prairie Wolf Paws and 4 Plainstrider Talons to Mull Thunderhorn in Bloodhoof.^Goblins and their servants have tainted our sacred water wells! We cannot allow this. To cleanse each well
column2: I must create a cleansing totem
column3: then you must bring the totem to the well and perform a cleansing ritual. First we will create a cleansing totem for the Winterhoof Water Well. To do this
column4: the land must offer its aid. Hunt prairie wolves for their paws and adult plainstriders for their talons. They are to the southwest. Return to me with the paws and talons
column5: <name>.

column1: The Ravaged Caravan^8^All^Mulgore^Morin Cloudstalker^Sealed Supply Crate^The Ravaged Caravan^^^Morin Cloudstalker wants you to examine the contents of a supply crate at the Ravaged Caravan.^A few days ago
column2: we found a Venture Co. caravan traveling under guard on the northern shore of Stonebull Lake. We'd lost two of our number in an earlier battle
column3: so we were quick to attack and lay waste to the caravan. We left their supply crates
column4: thinking that our torches would destroy anything of value
column5: but given that Venture Co. salvagers have been spotted near the burned wagons
column6: maybe we were wrong. Perhaps you could go to the caravan and examine the contents of the crates.

column1: The Hunt Continues^3^All^Mulgore^Grull Hawkwind^Grull Hawkwind^The Hunt Continues^The Hunt Begins^^Grull Hawkwind in Camp Narache wants you to bring him 10 Mountain Cougar Pelts.^A tauren skilled in the ways of the hunt knows that his prey is not for mere trophy. The beasts of the plains provide us with a means of survival. You will make quite an impression on the elders if you can bring back some highly valued Mountain Cougar Pelts. You can find the beasts lurking in the hills to the south. Our children need clothing and our tents need mending.
The Ravaged Caravan^8^All^Mulgore^Sealed Supply Crate^Morin Cloudstalker^The Ravaged Caravan^^The Venture Co.
column2: Supervisor Fizsprocket^Return the Venture Co. Documents to Morin Cloudstalker near Bloodhoof Village.^Prying open the lid reveals a tightly packed assortment of ore and minerals
column3: more evidence of the Venture Co.'s mining operation in Mulgore. On the top of the ore and minerals you remove a tightly bound sheaf of papers. Up in the foothills to the east
column4: you can barely hear the sounds of work
column5: and see smoke rising from a large fire.

column1: A Humble Task^2^All^Mulgore^Chief Hawkwind^Greatmother Hawkwind^A Humble Task^^^Chief Hawkwind wants you to search for his mother near the water well to the southeast of Camp Narache.^All members of the tribe share in the harmony of life. We live together and work together. Our commitment to one another carries with it a high degree of responsibility. I ask of you now a humble task. My mother set out this morning to fetch water from the well to the southeast of Narache. It has been quite some time now. Perhaps you could check on her for me while I attend to tribal matters here?

A Humble Task^3^All^Mulgore^Greatmother Hawkwind^Chief Hawkwind^A Humble Task^^^Take a Water Pitcher from the water well.^I have traveled many paths through life and these old legs lack the vigor they once had. I can still perform my duties to the tribe. Sometimes it just takes an old woman a little longer to do the task. But you look like an eager <class>. Let's put some of that youthful vitality to the test. Take a water pitcher from the well and bring it to my son
column2: the Chief
column3: in Camp Narache. Remember that even the most humble task can gain the recognition of elders.

column1: Winterhoof Cleansing^6^Tauren^Mulgore^Mull Thunderhorn^Mull Thunderhorn^^Poison Water^Thunderhorn Totem^Use the Winterhoof Cleansing Totem at the Winterhoof Water Well
column2: then return to Mull Thunderhorn.^I have crafted the totem to cleanse the Winterhoof Water Well. Now
column3: you must take it to the well and perform a cleansing ritual. You will find it to the southeast
column4: guarded by foul goblins! This will not be an easy task
column5: but you must do it if we are ever to use its waters again. Fortune to you
column6: <name>.

column1: Rites of the Earthmother^3^All^Mulgore^Chief Hawkwind^Seer Graytongue^A Humble Task^^^Travel to Seer Graytongue who lives in the hills directly south of Camp Narache.^Your willingness to perform a humble task for the tauren of Narache and your eagerness to learn are noble traits
column2: <name>. I believe one day you will be heralded in Thunder Bluff as a <class> of greatness. Before that you must embark on the Rites of the Earthmother
column3: of which there are three. The first test is the Rite of Strength. Travel to Seer Graytongue and tell him Chief Hawkwind has sent you. You will find the seer's abode directly to the south of Camp Narache
column4: tucked away in the hills.

column1: Thunderhorn Totem^7^All^Mulgore^Mull Thunderhorn^Mull Thunderhorn^^Winterhoof Cleansing^Thunderhorn Cleansing^Bring 6 Stalker Claws and 6 Cougar Claws to Mull Thunderhorn.^To create the Thunderhorn Cleansing Totem
column2: you must gather the claws of the predators of the Mulgore plains. Hunt prairie stalkers for their stalker claws and flatland cougars for their cougar claws
column3: then return to me. You will find the prairie stalkers and flatland cougars to the east and west.

column1: Rite of Strength^4^All^Mulgore^Seer Graytongue^Chief Hawkwind^A Humble Task^^Rites of the Earthmother^Kill Bristlebacks in Brambleblade Ravine and bring 8 Bristleback Belts to Chief Hawkwind in Camp Narache.^The Rites of the Earthmother are the steps a young tauren needs to take to gain respect in Thunder Bluff. First you must pass the Rite of Strength. In this test you must prove your bravery by slaying enemies of the tribe. Bristlebacks of Brambleblade Ravine to the east are encroaching on our tribal lands. They ambush our hunting parties and steal from the village by dark. Show your valor by slaying these villains and return to the Chief in Camp Narache with their belts as proof of your deeds.
Thunderhorn Cleansing^8^Tauren^Mulgore^Mull Thunderhorn^Mull Thunderhorn^^Thunderhorn Totem^Wildmane Totem^Use the Thunderhorn Cleansing Totem at the Thunderhorn Water Well
column2: then return to Mull.^The totem is ready
column3: <name>. And again
column4: it is your task to perform the ritual of cleansing. Go to the Thunderhorn Water Well
column5: north of the village
column6: and use the Thunderhorn Cleansing Totem in your ritual. After you do this
column7: return to me. May the spirits guide you.

column1: Wildmane Totem^10^All^Mulgore^Mull Thunderhorn^Mull Thunderhorn^^Thunderhorn Cleansing^Wildmane Cleansing^Bring 8 Prairie Alpha Teeth to Mull Thunderhorn in Bloodhoof Village.^There is but one water well left to cleanse
column2: named after the Wildmane clan. For this well to be pure
column3: the land must offer the teeth of a fierce predator
column4: the prairie wolf alpha. Find the alphas to the north
column5: then return to me when your hunt is finished. Alphas often wander around the base of our mighty city
column6: Thunder Bluff.

column1: Wildmane Cleansing^10^Tauren^Mulgore^Mull Thunderhorn^Mull Thunderhorn^^Wildmane Totem^^Use the Wildmane Cleansing Totem at the Wildmane Water Well
column2: then return to Mull Thunderhorn.^Your cleansing of the Winterhoof and Thunderhorn wells is spoken among the spirits
column3: young <name>. The Wildmane Totem is made
column4: and your last task lies ahead. The Wildmane Water Well lies north of Thunder Bluff. Perform the ritual! Heal the land of the goblins' poisons! Let clean water flow once again!

column1: Swoop Hunting^6^All^Mulgore^Harken Windtotem^Harken Windtotem^^^^Bring 8 Trophy Swoop Quills to Harken Windtotem in Bloodhoof Village.^The swoop is a cunning bird
column2: and difficult to find and hunt. A collection of Swoop Quills is a badge of cleverness and determination for a hunter. If you are willing to take up this task
column3: then enter the plains and hunt the swoop. Bring me their quills
column4: and bring honor to your clan. The swoops may be found anywhere in Mulgore
column5: but your eyes must be sharp to spot them
column6: and your hooves must be quick to catch them.

column1: An Ambassador of Evil^44^Alliance^Badlands^Historian Karnik^Advisor Belgrum^Passing Word of a Threat^^The Lost Tablets of Will^Kill Ambassador Infernus in Angor Fortress and bring proof of his death to Advisor Belgrum in Ironforge.^Ambassador Infernus was sent to Angor Fortress by Ragnaros himself to mind the Shadowforge seeking lost artifacts in Uldaman. It has already meant tremendous casualties for our people
column2: but it has obviously grown worse. I hesitate to guess how many artifacts they would be able to find and use against Ironforge. Our goal is simple
column3: <class>. Return to the Badlands and destroy Ambassador Infernus. Once the threat is eliminated
column4: return to Advisor Belgrum with proof of your victory. It is in your hands now.

column1: Rites of the Earthmother^5^All^Mulgore^Chief Hawkwind^Baine Bloodhoof^^Rite of Strength^Rite of Vision^Take the Totem of Hawkwind to Baine Bloodhoof in Bloodhoof Village. Follow the road out of Camp Narache.^For you to continue with the Rites of the Earthmother you must pass two more tests. It is time for you to broaden your experience
column2: <name>. Travel to Bloodhoof Village and seek out the Chief
column3: Baine Bloodhoof
column4: son of Cairne. There you may continue your journey and earn the acceptance of the elders of Thunder Bluff. Take this totem to Baine. He will recognize my carvings and help you on your path. Follow the road out of Camp Narache and travel with haste. Do not stray or you will lose your way.

column1: The Venture Co.^10^All^Mulgore^Morin Cloudstalker^Morin Cloudstalker^^The Ravaged Caravan^^Kill 14 Venture Co. Workers and 6 Venture Co. Supervisors for Morin Cloudstalker at Bloodhoof Village.^This explains the buildup of Venture Co. employees and equipment we've seen in Mulgore. Those goblins... their company is expanding too quickly for their own good. It's how they say
column2: show a goblin something
column3: and you can hear the scales in the background. Greedy little things
column4: they are. Unfortunately for their business enterprise
column5: we tauren cannot allow them to conduct their operations in our lands. Go to their mine northeast of the ravaged caravan and send them a message.

column1: Supervisor Fizsprocket^12^All^Mulgore^Morin Cloudstalker^Morin Cloudstalker^^The Ravaged Caravan^^Kill Supervisor Fizsprocket and return his clipboard to Morin Cloudstalker at Bloodhoof Village.^According to the documents you salvaged from the caravan
column2: the Venture Co. created many plans to attempt to drive us from our lands here
column3: so that they could have free reign to plunder our lands. The depths that they would sink to accomplish their goals disgusts and appalls me. I want the mastermind behind their plans killed. His name is Supervisor Fizsprocket
column4: you will find him at the Venture Co. mine east of the ravaged caravan. Bring me his clipboard
column5: we shall see if we find out anything useful.

column1: Mazzranache^8^All^Mulgore^Maur Raincaller^Maur Raincaller^^^^Bring a Prairie Wolf Heart
column2: Flatland Cougar Femur
column3: Plainstrider Scale and Swoop Gizzard to Maur Raincaller at Bloodhoof Village.^My grandfather told me stories about his battles with a strider named Mazzranache. He told me of its demonic red eyes
column4: razor-sharp talons and venomous bite. As fortune would have it
column5: while traveling across the plains
column6: I encountered it
column7: and it took a nasty bite from my shoulder. He was as terrible as my grandfather described. I will need some hard-to-find animal parts to clean the infection from his bite: a wolf heart
column8: cougar femur
column9: plainstrider scale and swoop gizzard. Hurry
column10: time is of the essence.

column1: Rite of Vision^6^All^Mulgore^Baine Bloodhoof^Zarlman Two-Moons^Rite of Vision^Rites of the Earthmother^^Speak with Zarlman Two-Moons in Bloodhoof Village.^The Rite of Vision
column2: one of the Rites of the Earthmother
column3: will help guide you toward earning the respect of the elders of Thunder Bluff. Our people have learned that the land is our most holy provider. In order to take part in the ritualistic vision
column4: you must speak with the spiritual leader of the village
column5: Zarlman Two-Moons.

column1: Gathering Leather^8^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Veren Tallstrider^Veren Tallstrider^^^Kodo Hide Bag^Bring 12 pieces of Light Leather to Veren Tallstrider in Thunder Bluff.^Greetings
column2: young one. You have a gleam in your eye; I can tell you are eager to venture back to the plains for the hunt. May you bring honor to your clan! I work with the skins of beasts
column3: fashioning them into clothes and armor for the people of Thunder Bluff. If you hunt beasts and bring me their skins
column4: then I will fashion something for you.

column1: Kodo Hide Bag^10^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Veren Tallstrider^Veren Tallstrider^^Gathering Leather^^Bring 4 Light Leather and 4 Coarse Thread to Veren Tallstrider in Thunder Bluff.^The kodo beasts of Mulgore are strong and sturdy -- traits much respected among us. If you are skilled in leatherworking and wish the knowledge to make a Kodo Hide Bag
column2: then bring me supplies for my trade. Do this
column3: and I will share my knowledge with you.

column1: The Demon Scarred Cloak^12^All^Mulgore^Demon Scarred Cloak^Skorn Whitecloud^^^^Find someone who knows of Ghost Howl.^The ragged hide of Ghost Howl still bears a terrible wound
column2: gained from the wolf's battles against the Burning Legion. Perhaps someone in Bloodhoof Village should know of Ghost Howl's demise....

column1: Rite of Vision^7^All^Mulgore^Zarlman Two-Moons^Zarlman Two-Moons^Rite of Vision^^Rite of Vision^Collect 2 Well Stones and 2 Ambercorn and bring them back to Zarlman Two-Moons in Bloodhoof Village.^In order to pass through the Rite of Vision
column2: you must gather the reagents needed to make the Water of the Seers. I will need well stones
column3: which can be found around the water wells in Mulgore. With those I will combine Ambercorn
column4: which fall beneath the mighty trees in our land. These reagents contain magical elements
column5: and when brewed and consumed before the tribal fire
column6: will cause you to encounter a vision. Follow it
column7: and it will lead you to the next step of this holy quest.

column1: Rite of Vision^7^All^Mulgore^Zarlman Two-Moons^Seer Wiserunner^Rite of Vision^Rite of Vision^^Consume the Water of the Seers in front of the tribal fire in Bloodhoof Village and follow the vision once it appears.^I now present you with the Water of the Seers. When you are ready
column2: consume the waters near the tribal fire. Once you have ingested the holy waters
column3: it will take a few moments before the vision materializes before the fire. At that point
column4: it is up to you to follow it to your destiny....

column1: Rite of Wisdom^10^All^Mulgore^Seer Wiserunner^Ancestral Spirit^Rite of Vision^^^Travel to Red Rocks east of Thunder Bluff and speak with the Ancestral Spirit.^To gain acceptance amongst the elders of Thunder Bluff you must next complete the Rite of Wisdom. Now that you have passed the Rite of Vision
column2: the ancestral spirits of Red Rocks will give you the blessing of our ancestors. Only those who have drunk from the Water of Seers can gain the blessing. Travel east of Thunder Bluff
column3: to Red Rocks and seek out the Ancestral Spirit
column4: <name>.

column1: Journey into Thunder Bluff^10^All^Mulgore^Ancestral Spirit^Cairne Bloodhoof^Rite of Vision^^^Speak with Cairne Bloodhoof in Thunder Bluff.^You will now be revered within our great city. Any <race> worthy of completing the Rites of the Earthmother earns that honor. For your final quest
column2: seek out our noble leader
column3: Cairne Bloodhoof
column4: who dwells atop the highest mesa in Thunder Bluff.

column1: Rites of the Earthmother^14^Horde^Mulgore^Cairne Bloodhoof^Cairne Bloodhoof^Rite of Vision^^^Cairne Bloodhoof in Thunder Bluff wants you to bring him the Horn of Arra'chea.^You have passed the Rites of the Earthmother and earned your place in Thunder Bluff. But in order to maintain the spot that you strived so hard to achieve
column2: you must continue to prove your worth to your people. We are hunters
column3: <name>. Down below in Mulgore there is a mighty kodo named Arra'chea. Show me your skills in the ways of tracking and hunting by bringing me the Horn of Arra'chea.

column1: This Is Going to Be Hard^42^All^Badlands^Lucien Tosselwrench^Lotwil Veriatus^This Is Going to Be Hard^^^Bring Cog #5 to Lotwil Veriatus.^Okay
column2: here you go. I'm going to be over here... behind cover. Feel free to join me.

column1: This Is Going to Be Hard^45^All^Badlands^Lotwil Veriatus^Lotwil Veriatus^This Is Going to Be Hard^^^Defeat the Fam'retor Guardian and bring Lotwil's Shackles of Elemental Binding back to Lotwil Veriatus.^Haha! Done! The shackles are done! It's time
column2: Lucien. It's time
column3: Servo! Are you ready to bear witness to the perfect blend of alchemy
column4: engineering
column5: and the arcane
column6: <name>? I shall summon forth a powerful elemental now. This is a groundbreaking day for all of us.

column1: The Battleboars^4^All^Mulgore^Grull Hawkwind^Grull Hawkwind^The Hunt Continues^^^Grull Hawkwind in Camp Narache wants you to kill Battleboars and bring back 8 Battleboar Snouts and 8 Battleboar Flanks.^The Battleboars of Brambleblade Ravine to the east are encroaching on our tribal hunting grounds. They are trained to be malicious by the Bristleback Quilboars with whom we are at war. Go and slay the vile creatures and bring back some snouts and flanks so that we can make stew for our young.

Broken Alliances^43^Horde^Badlands^Gorn^Gorn^Broken Alliances^^^Kill Boss Tho'grun and bring the Sign of the Earth to Gorn in Kargath.^From the Horde's alliance with the dragon Deathwing during the Second War
column2: we know that two of his lieutenants
column3: Blacklash and Hematus
column4: were imprisoned within Lethlor Ravine far to the east. We must silence our depraved allies of old to restore honor to the Horde! We hired Tho'grun and his band of ogre mercenaries to help us obtain the Sign of the Earth
column5: a key needed to unlock the drakes' prison. Tho'grun betrayed us though
column6: overwhelming us and taking it for himself. Go to Camp Boff and take it back!

column1: A Threat Within^1^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Deputy Willem^Marshal McBride^A Threat Within^^Brotherhood of Thieves
column2: Eagan Peltskinner^Speak with Marshal McBride.^I hope you strapped your belt on tight
column3: young <class>
column4: because there is work to do here in Northshire. And I don't mean farming. The Stormwind guards are hard pressed to keep the peace here
column5: with so many of us in distant lands and so many threats pressing close. And so we're enlisting the aid of anyone willing to defend their home. And their alliance. If you're here to answer the call
column6: then speak with my superior
column7: Marshal McBride. He's inside the abbey behind me.

column1: Vanquish the Betrayers^7^Horde^Durotar^Gar'Thok^Gar'Thok^Vanquish the Betrayers^^^Kill 10 Kul Tiras Sailors
column2: 8 Kul Tiras Marines and Lieutenant Benedict and return to Gar'Thok in Razor Hill.^Led by Admiral Proudmoore
column3: the humans of Kul Tiras encroached on Durotar
column4: violating the Warchief's pact made with Jaina Proudmoore in order to defeat Archimonde years ago. The human aggression was repelled and Tiragarde Keep fell. But recently
column5: the Admiral's reserves
column6: led by Lieutenant Benedict
column7: have retaken the keep and once again pose a threat to our homeland. These humans show no respect for diplomacy. Prove your honor and travel south to Tiragarde Keep to eliminate the human invaders.

column1: Thwarting Kolkar Aggression^8^Horde^Durotar^Lar Prowltusk^Lar Prowltusk^A Strategic Alliance^^^Lar Prowltusk outside of Sen'jin Village wants you to destroy the 3 sets of Attack Plans held within Kolkar Crag.^Lower your voice
column2: <class>. The Kolkar centaurs lie just over the ridge to the west in Kolkar Crag. Last night while they were raiding
column3: I snuck into their village and discovered that the dirty beasts have a three-tiered attack planned on the trolls and orcs of Durotar. We mustn't let their invasion come to fruition. Perhaps you can muster the might needed to infiltrate Kolkar Crag and destroy their attack plans. Last I saw
column4: they had divided them up amongst three of their leaders.

column1: The New Horde^1^All^Durotar^Eitrigg^Gornek^The New Horde^^^Report to Gornek in the Den.^Throm'ka
column2: <class>. I am Eitrigg
column3: charged by Thrall to oversee the training of recruits. The Horde has changed from what it once was. There was a time where I left the Horde
column4: disillusioned by the growing influence of the power-hungry pawns of the Burning Legion. During my exile
column5: I was taken prisoner by a group of humans
column6: but was rescued by the Warchief. Hearing his vision of the Horde free of demonic influence
column7: guided by the shamans
column8: I returned. Gornek will have further instructions for you.

column1: Cutting Teeth^2^Horde^Durotar^Gornek^Gornek^The New Horde^^Sting of the Scorpid
column2: Simple Parchment
column3: Simple Tablet
column4: Etched Tablet
column5: Encrypted Tablet
column6: Rune-Inscribed Tablet
column7: Hallowed Tablet
column8: Glyphic Tablet
column9: Etched Parchment
column10: Encrypted Parchment
column11: Rune-Inscribed Parchment
column12: Tainted Parchment
column13: Galgar's Cactus Apple Surprise^Kill 8 Mottled Boars then return to Gornek at the Den.^The first order of business will be to put a little strength in your backbone. I could send you out to the Barrens to hunt kodo
column16: you're more useful to us alive than dead. I believe you would find a good match with the mottled boars you'll find to the north of here.

column1: Sting of the Scorpid^3^Horde^Durotar^Gornek^Gornek^^Cutting Teeth^^Get 8 Scorpid Worker Tails for Gornek in the Den.^Powerful warrior and awkward novice alike have fallen to the venomous sting of the scorpid. You will find large numbers of scorpids northwest of here. Bring me eight of their tails as proof of your prowess in battle. The antidote for their sting is actually made from venom extracted from their stingers. We keep large quantities of antidote for scorpid venom on hand to heal young bloods just like you... But I'm sure you won't be needing any of that
column2: will you?

column1: Sarkoth^5^All^Durotar^Hana'zua^Hana'zua^Sarkoth^^^Kill Sarkoth and bring his claw back to Hana'zua.^<class>! I thought I would die out here with none to know of it. While I was hunting the scorpids of the Valley
column2: I came across a particularly vicious-looking one. Hurling myself at it
column3: I managed to inflict a massive blow to its claw before it closed around my leg. I wasn't ready for its stinger though
column4: and it sliced down and into my chest
column5: cutting into my flesh and letting my blood. Please
column6: you must kill the scorpid for me! My honor must be upheld! I fought it up on the plateau to the south.

column1: Carry Your Weight^7^Horde^Durotar^Furl Scornbrow^Furl Scornbrow^^^^Furl Scornbrow in the Razor Hill watchtower wants 8 Canvas Scraps.^Age has rendered me useless in battle. Now I make myself useful in other ways. From this vantage point I watch for invaders. As our strength here grows
column2: I find myself blowing the signal horn less and less. To pass the time I fashion goods to help younger
column3: more able warriors defend our homeland. For you
column4: I can fashion you a bag for your belongings. If such an item would be of use to you
column5: bring me some canvas
column6: a material common to the humans and centaurs.

column1: Vile Familiars^4^Horde^Durotar^Zureetha Fargaze^Zureetha Fargaze^Vile Familiars^^Burning Blade Medallion^Kill 8 Vile Familiars.^I trust the Valley of Trials will teach you much
column2: young <class>. I was sent to the Valley to guide you
column3: but I have discovered a growing taint here... A group that calls itself the Burning Blade has a coven here in the Valley of Trials. They are skulking in a cave to the northeast
column4: and their Vile Familiars have spilled from its mouth to cause havoc. As your first task against the Burning Blade
column5: I bid you
column6: defeat these familiars. Slay many and
column7: if you survive
column8: return to me.

column1: Broken Alliances^50^Horde^Badlands^Gorn^Gorn^Broken Alliances^^^Use the Sign of the Earth to activate the Pillars of Diamond
column2: Opal
column3: and Amethyst and obtain the Runestones.^The Seal of the Earth is held by three runestones
column4: held in the Pillars of Diamond
column5: Opal
column6: and Amethyst in Lethlor Ravine. Using the Sign of the Earth
column7: you will be able to remove the runestones and unlock the Seal of the Earth. Be wary though
column8: <name>
column9: the black drakes Blacklash and Hematus are not to be trifled with. See them dead and return their bindings to me. To reach the ravine
column10: travel to the far eastern part of the Badlands. Be careful though
column11: for the ravine is home to countless drakes.

column1: Burning Blade Medallion^5^Horde^Durotar^Zureetha Fargaze^Zureetha Fargaze^Vile Familiars^^^Bring the Burning Blade Medallion to Zureetha Fargaze
column2: outside The Den.^Through my divinations
column3: I see that an item of power hides deep within the Burning Blade Coven
column4: guarded by beasts and black magic. It is called the Burning Blade Medallion
column5: and your next task is to find it and remove it from the coven. But be wary
column6: for the medallion may be possessed by an agent of the Burning Blade
column7: and if so then the agent's power would be greater than the familiars you have already encountered. Go
column8: <name>. You will find the coven in a cave
column9: to the north and west.

column1: Sarkoth^5^All^Durotar^Hana'zua^Gornek^Sarkoth^^^Bring the news of Hana'zua's plight to Gornek at the Den.^Seeing the deed you have done for me steels my heart. I cannot fall so easily! I must endure! But it remains that I cannot make the trek back to the Den unassisted. Please
column2: <name>
column3: return to the Den and tell Gornek of my situation. Perhaps he can help me.

column1: Report to Sen'jin Village^5^Horde^Durotar^Zureetha Fargaze^Master Gadrin^Vile Familiars^^Report to Orgnil^Speak with Master Gadrin in Sen'jin Village.^Your trials against the Burning Blade are finished... here in the Valley. But I want you to report your findings. Go to the troll village of Sen'jin and seek out Master Gadrin. Sen'jin Village is east out of the valley
column2: then right at the fork. Tell Gadrin of the Burning Blade
column3: and that they have reached the Valley of Trials. Discover from him if they have yet reached Sen'jin. Go
column4: <name>
column5: and be swift. I fear the evil found in the Burning Blade Coven is but the herald of a larger threat...

column1: Dark Storms^12^Horde^Durotar^Orgnil Soulscar^Orgnil Soulscar^^Report to Orgnil^Margoz^Bring Fizzle's Claw to Orgnil Soulscar in Razor Hill.^We cannot allow the Burning Blade a foothold in Durotar! We must destroy them before their evil festers! I have undergone my own investigations and found that a Burning Blade warlock
column2: the goblin Fizzle Darkstorm
column3: has camped within Thunder Ridge to the northwest. There he and his cultist minions spread chaos. Find and defeat Fizzle
column4: and bring me his dead claw!

column1: Minshina's Skull^9^Horde^Durotar^Master Gadrin^Master Gadrin^^^^Retrieve Minshina's skull from the circle of power on the Echo Isles.^I hear the voice of my brother
column2: Minshina
column3: calling to me in my dreams. He was taken by Zalazane
column4: the warlock on the Echo Isles to the east. And he is dead. But death is not freedom for my brother. Minshina's spirit was trapped within his own skull by Zalazane's magics. In my dreams I see it with other skulls
column5: in a circle of power on the largest Echo Isle. As long as it remains there my brother's soul is doomed. Please
column6: <name>. Find the circle and retrieve Minshina's skull. Bring it to me. Free him!

column1: Ak'Zeloth^13^Horde^Durotar^Neeru Fireblade^Ak'Zeloth^Neeru Fireblade^^^Speak with Ak'Zeloth in the Barrens.^Since the last great war when the Burning Legion was defeated
column2: I have searched for sources of demonic corruption in orc society. The collar you brought me confirms my fears. It belongs to the Burning Blade
column3: a cult that rallies around an item of demonic power. It is called the Demon Seed
column4: and it resides in the Barrens atop Dreadmist Peak. It must be destroyed! Go to Far Watch Post
column5: on the border of the Barrens to the west
column6: and speak with my assistant
column7: Ak'Zeloth. He will direct you further.

column1: Need for a Cure^9^Horde^Durotar^Rhinag^Rhinag^^^^Find Kor'ghan in Orgrimmar and get the Venomtail Antidote. Then bring the antidote to Rhinag near the northwestern border of Durotar.^<name>... your timing is perfect. I just hope I can compliment your haste as well. I was careless while fighting a few of the venomtails nearby
column2: and one of them stung me deeply. I can feel its poison weakening me even as we speak. At this rate
column3: I got maybe an hour left to live. But I'll need your help if I'm to do so... Kor'ghan in Orgrimmar knows how to make the antidote. Find him... and hurry
column4: <name>. I won't be able to last much longer. He should be in the Cleft of Shadow.

column1: Finding the Antidote^9^Horde^Durotar^Kor'ghan^Kor'ghan^^^^Bring 4 Venomtail Poison Sacs to Kor'ghan in Orgrimmar.^Venomtails are some of the deadliest scorpids in Durotar. It was unwise for Rhinag to hunt them without having some of the antidote with him
column2: but right now
column3: chastising is the last thing he needs. Bring me a few venomtail poison sacs from any of the venomtails near the entrance of Orgrimmar and I'll make an antidote for him. Make haste
column4: <name>. One of our own needs your help.

column1: Break a Few Eggs^8^Horde^Durotar^Cook Torka^Cook Torka^^^^Bring 3 Taillasher Eggs to Cook Torka in Razor Hill.^Bah! I almost forgot I need to get breakfast ready. <name>
column2: get yourself movin' and get me some taillasher eggs. I'll need at least three of them if I'm going to have enough for tomorrow's meal. The Bloodtalon taillashers can be fierce
column3: and protect their eggs to the death more often than not. They sometimes bury their eggs too deep in the earth to uncover safely
column4: but if you head to the Echo Isles to the southeast of Sen'jin Village
column5: you can usually find them all over those islands.

column1: Lost But Not Forgotten^11^Horde^Durotar^Misha Tor'kren^Misha Tor'kren^^^^Bring a sign of Kron's fate to Misha Tor'kren at the farmstead northwest of Razor Hill.^<name>
column2: please
column3: can you help me? My son Kron went hunting days ago
column4: and he still hasn't returned. He went west towards the Barrens to hunt crocolisks along Southfury River. I fear the worst. As strong as he was
column5: his stubborn pride has always drawn him into trouble. I warned him that the crocolisks were powerful and vicious. He grew angry and stormed off. If you can't find him
column6: at least bring me a sign of his fate... even if you have to open up the stomach of every crocolisk along the Southfury's banks.

column1: Practical Prey^8^Horde^Durotar^Vel'rin Fang^Vel'rin Fang^^^^Bring 4 Durotar Tiger Furs to Vel'rin Fang in Sen'jin Village.^Many of the hides we use come from Durotar tigers
column2: <name>. Blankets
column3: armor
column4: tents: there are a great many reasons we hunt the beasts
column5: and many reasons we let them thrive at the same time. The time has come for us to cull the flock
column6: so to speak. Our numbers grow
column7: and our needs are beginning to overwhelm our stocks. I need more hides if I'm to prepare suitable goods for our people. Bring me 4 Durotar tiger furs
column8: and I shall reward you. You can find them on the islands south of here.

column1: A Solvent Spirit^7^Horde^Durotar^Master Vornal^Master Vornal^^^^Bring 4 Intact Makrura Eyes and 8 vials of Crawler Mucus to Master Vornal in Sen'jin Village.^Although my eyes fail me
column2: I still can see clearly enough. More often I must rely on my alchemical skills to aid me in magics that once came easily. But I refuse to take on an apprentice--no troll or orc worthy enough has ever come forward. Are you worthy? Yes
column3: of course you are... of course you think you are. I need a few things. Will you get them for me? I need intact makrura eyes
column4: and vials of crawler mucus. You can find them on any makrura or crawler in Durotar. We shall speak again soon.

column1: Chen's Empty Keg^15^Horde^The Barrens^Chen's Empty Keg^Brewmaster Drohn^Chen's Empty Keg^^^Find someone who knows about Chen's Empty Keg.^A small placard on one of the ends of the keg says
column2: "Chen Stormstout- May your spirit be raised and always raise your spirits."

column1: Chen's Empty Keg^15^Horde^The Barrens^Brewmaster Drohn^Brewmaster Drohn^Chen's Empty Keg^^^Bring 5 Savannah Lion Tusks
column2: 5 Plainstrider Kidneys
column3: and 1 Thunder Lizard Horn to Brewmaster Drohn in Ratchet.^Would you like a taste of Chen's namesake? Ahh
column4: the stormstout is a mighty brew. Chen taught the recipe to my mentor
column5: and my mentor passed it on to me. I'll need you to get me a few things
column6: but I can tell you this: the kick is worth it. Bring me 5 savannah lion tusks from any savannah lion
column7: 5 plainstrider kidneys from any plainstrider
column8: and 1 thunder lizard horn from any species of thunder lizard. That should do the trick nicely. You can find these ingredients throughout the Barrens.

column1: Chen's Empty Keg^24^Horde^The Barrens^Brewmaster Drohn^Brewmaster Drohn^Chen's Empty Keg^^^Bring 5 Lightning Glands
column2: 1 Thunderhawk Saliva Gland and 1 Kodo Liver to Brewmaster Drohn in Ratchet.^Good stuff
column3: that stormstout
column4: huh? I have another recipe that I learned from Chen. Would you be interested? It won't take long to make
column5: and it might be useful if you plan on adventuring some more. Bring me 5 lightning glands from any stormhide
column6: 1 thunderhawk saliva gland from greater thunderhawks
column7: and a kodo liver from any of the Barrens' kodos. Like I said
column8: this stuff has kick; it's the trogg ale that I mentioned to you before.

column1: Report to Orgnil^7^Horde^Durotar^Master Gadrin^Orgnil Soulscar^^Report to Sen'jin Village^Dark Storms^Speak with Orgnil Soulscar in Razor Hill.^We at Sen'jin Village are not without our own troubles
column2: and we thank you for your aid. But the news you bring regarding the Burning Blade could be trouble for everyone. There is an orc stationed at Razor Hill
column3: Orgnil Soulscar
column4: who polices Durotar from evils such as the Burning Blade! Go to Orgnil and tell him of our plight
column5: as well as your news from the Valley of Trials. He will want to know these things. Razor Hill lies to the north.

column1: Je'neu of the Earthen Ring^27^Horde^Ashenvale^Mastok Wrilehiss^Je'neu Sancrea^The Befouled Element^^^Bring the Befouled Water Globe to Je'neu Sancrea at Zoram'gar Outpost
column2: Ashenvale.^The Earthen Ring is a shamanistic group dedicated to studying and preserving the elements. They have forgotten more about crazy old gods
column3: ancient legends and lore than most scholars will ever know. Lucky for you
column4: I know someone in the Earthen Ring here in Ashenvale. Head over to Zoram'gar Outpost on the coast of the Zoram Strand; show Je'neu Sancrea what you found. If anyone can figure out that globe's significance
column5: it'd be him.

column1: From The Wreckage....^8^Horde^Durotar^Gar'Thok^Gar'Thok^Vanquish the Betrayers^^^Gar'Thok of Razor Hill wants you to retrieve 3 Gnomish Tools from the wreckage off the coast.^One of my most observant scouts brings back word that the wreckage of Proudmoore's fleet still remains off the coast of Durotar
column2: just east of Tiragarde Keep. It is no secret that the humans
column3: in alliance with those foul little creatures known as gnomes
column4: have an advanced knowledge of mechanics. We must have a complete understanding of all our potential enemies. And our people will benefit from this new knowledge as well. Swim through the wreckage
column5: <name>
column6: and retrieve for me the tools of the Alliance.

column1: Zalazane^10^Horde^Durotar^Master Gadrin^Master Gadrin^^^^Defeat Zalazane.^The witchdoctor Zalazane dwells on the Echo Isles to the east. They are the isles we once called home. From there he sends his trolls to the mainland
column2: to hex our people and drag more of them under his sway. He must be stopped. Defeat Zalazane and his minions -- former Darkspear trolls
column3: now lost to us. Bring me his head and I will know his reign of evil is over.

column1: Skull Rock^12^Horde^Durotar^Margoz^Margoz^Margoz^^Neeru Fireblade^Gather Searing Collars from the cultists in Skull Rock.^<name>. The Burning Blade has infested the cave east of Orgrimmar known as Skull Rock. Inside that cave they perform vile rituals
column2: and burn their own flesh with Searing Collars. By wearing these collars
column3: I believe the cultists attune themselves to demonic power. But to confirm this
column4: I must have a collection of the collars to study. Go to Skull Rock and gather Searing Collars from the cultists you find there. Bring them to me
column5: and I will uncover their secrets.

column1: Margoz^12^Horde^Durotar^Orgnil Soulscar^Margoz^Margoz^Dark Storms^^Speak with Margoz.^One of our Shamans
column2: Margoz
column3: knows more of the Burning Blade's corruption. He speaks of a cave called Skull Rock in the mountains - just outside Orgrimmar! - that shelters a large band of Burning Blade cultists. Before you go to Skull Rock speak with Margoz. He is wise and his council is valued. He is camped to the northeast
column4: between the coast and Drygulch Ravine. Follow his advice
column5: but whatever Margoz says
column6: <name>
column7: I still want you to crush those cultists!

column1: Neeru Fireblade^12^Horde^Durotar^Margoz^Neeru Fireblade^Neeru Fireblade^Skull Rock^^Bring an Example Collar to Neeru Fireblade in Orgrimmar.^The Searing Collars you brought me are powerful
column2: demonic implements. Divining their origin is
column3: I'm afraid
column4: beyond my skills as a shaman. We will need a warlock to study them. Take a searing collar to Neeru Fireblade. Although he is a skilled warlock
column5: he professes to use his powers to thwart demons
column6: and claims his research in the occult is benign. Be that true or false
column7: we may need his aid against the demonic cult in Durotar. You may find Neeru in Orgrimmar in the Cleft of Shadow.

column1: The Admiral's Orders^7^Horde^Durotar^Aged Envelope^Gar'Thok^The Admiral's Orders^^^Take Admiral Proudmoore's Orders to Gar'Thok in Razor Hill.^You open the aged and weathered envelope and discover an official looking document. You recognize the seal of Admiral Proudmoore. This looks important. Perhaps Gar'Thok
column2: the commander of Razor Hill
column3: would be interested in having this information.

column1: The Admiral's Orders^7^Horde^Durotar^Gar'Thok^Vol'jin^The Admiral's Orders^^^Deliver Admiral Proudmoore's Orders to Vol'jin in Thrall's chamber in Orgrimmar.^Humans cannot be trusted. We fought alongside them with a weary heart
column2: knowing they would betray us one day. Admiral Proudmoore's death was not enough to stop his legacy of deceit. The human scum had his plans well laid out before he ever met his demise. His reign won't even die with Benedict it seems. Who knows how long it will be before the next waves of Proudmoore's men land upon our shores. We need to get these orders to Vol'jin in Orgrimmar immediately! He can be found in Thrall's chamber.

column1: Burning Shadows^12^Horde^Durotar^Eye of Burning Shadow^Neeru Fireblade^^^^Take this eye to Neeru Fireblade in Orgrimmar.^<Words emanate from the pendant and into your mind.> Gazz'uz? Gazz'uz...report! There is word of your discovery in Skull Rock. You must prepare for an attack! Gazz'uz
column2: I order you to speak! Speak or I will make sure Neeru Fireblade knows of your presence
column3: and he will descend on you with swift brutality. Do not test your skills against Neeru... ...Gazz'uz
column4: are you there...?

column1: A Sacred Burial^10^All^Mulgore^Lorekeeper Raintotem^Lorekeeper Raintotem^^^^Lorekeeper Raintotem wants you to kill 8 Bristleback Interlopers at Red Rocks.^Only the most valiant tauren are laid to rest at Red Rocks
column2: our sacred burial ground. It is an honor bestowed upon the great warriors who helped found and defend Thunder Bluff and those who have given their lives for the greater good of their tribes and chieftains. But it appears a foul menace has made its way onto our holy land. A band of Bristleback Interlopers is ravaging the grave site and I am too old and past my prime to drive them away. They must be driven off with force
column3: <name>.

column1: Winds in the Desert^9^All^Durotar^Rezlak^Rezlak^Winds in the Desert^^^Retrieve 5 Sacks of Supplies and return them to Rezlak near Orgrimmar.^I'm Rezlak
column2: one of Gazlowe's boys. Boss sent me to help the orcs here in Durotar. Things'd been going good except for the caravans. Can't manage to keep them safe! Makes my job a little harder
column3: you know? The last shipment--they promised it'd get through!--was snatched by the Dustwind harpies of...where was it...Razorwind Canyon? I gotta have those supplies or I'll never get anything done! Follow the big canyon to the south
column4: you'll find the ravine cut right into the west and east sides of the walls.

column1: Securing the Lines^11^All^Durotar^Rezlak^Rezlak^Winds in the Desert^^^Kill 12 Dustwind Savages and 8 Dustwind Storm Witches for Rezlak near Drygulch Ravine.^Gazlowe told me once
column2: "Rezlak. There's one thing you need to know in life
column3: and that's if you want something done well
column4: do it yourself." I can't deal with losing all our caravans
column5: so I'm just going to take matters into my own hands. Drygulch Ravine lies through the eastern part of Razorwind Canyon. If we kill all the harpies there
column6: the routes will be safe. Of course
column7: there was one other thing that Gazlowe taught me
column8: and that's "You can get anything done for a price." So
column9: going to help me out
column10: <name>?

column1: Rescue OOX-09/HL!^48^All^The Hinterlands^Homing Robot OOX-09/HL^Oglethorpe Obnoticus^Find OOX-09/HL!^^An OOX of Your Own^Escort OOX-09/HL to safety
column2: then report to Oglethorpe Obnoticus in Booty Bay.^The gnome's voice crackles once again from the robot: "I need to move OOX-09/HL to an open
column3: safe place so it can begin a lengthy take-off procedure. It has built-in cloaking
column4: but I need time on my end to make it operational again. Escort the robot from its current location to
column5: let's say
column6: some big rocks that obscure visibility! That should be a perfect place
column7: and long enough
column8: to get things online!" "Escort it safely and then come talk to me in Booty Bay! Oglethorpe Obnoticus - out!"

column1: Encroachment^10^Horde^Durotar^Gar'Thok^Gar'Thok^^^^Kill 4 Razormane Quilboars
column2: 4 Razormane Scouts
column3: 4 Razormane Dustrunners and 4 Razormane Battleguards for Gar'Thok at Razor Hill.^When we arrived
column4: the Razormane quilboars possessed much of the land
column5: and proved a thorn in our sides. Through our efforts we have driven out the largest part of their numbers
column6: but still they remain well-fortified in some areas. It has gone on long enough
column7: however. For our own protection
column8: we cannot allow the Razormane any hold in our lands. Their camps can be found to the west of here. Look for the brambles and you will find them. Today we drive them from Durotar
column9: tomorrow
column10: perhaps from all of Kalimdor.

column1: Scholomance^55^Horde^Western Plaguelands^High Executor Derrington^Apothecary Dithers^Scholomance^All Along the Watchtowers^^Speak with Apothecary Dithers at the Bulwark
column2: Western Plaguelands.^On the island of Caer Darrow lies Scholomance - a school that serves as a stronghold for the Scourge. Our enemy dwells within
column3: safely allowed to pursue research that strengthens their power. A door bars the way
column4: and try as we might no entry is to be had without a proper key. Apothecary Dithers is well versed on Scholomance
column5: and has an idea how to obtain a key. You have proved your value to me as someone who can get things done; I now entrust this task to you. Speak with him on this matter.

column1: Conscript of the Horde^12^Horde^Durotar^Takrin Pathseeker^Kargal Battlescar^Conscript of the Horde^^^Follow the western road from Razor Hill to the Barrens over a bridge.^Hmm
column2: you look pretty strong. Listen
column3: my good friend Kargal needs some new recruits for Barrens duty. I know you want to do what's right for the Horde. Well
column4: this is your chance. Take this recruitment letter to Kargal and see if he'll sign it.

column1: Another Power Source?^46^Horde^Tanaris^Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle^Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle^^Slake That Thirst^^Bring 10 Wastewander Water Pouches to Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle in Gadgetzan in exchange for another power source.^Let me guess - you didn't get whatever world-ending
column2: nefarious deed you were doing done in time. No wait
column3: better still... you dropped it in the sand! Well
column4: whatever the reason
column5: I do have additional power sources I will sell to you. This time
column6: however
column7: it will cost you ten
column8: YES TEN Wastewander Water Pouches! Times are tough all around
column9: <name>
column10: and power sources don't grow on trees! Hrm
column11: but what if they did. Maybe we could MAKE a power source tree...

column1: Crossroads Conscription^12^Horde^Durotar^Kargal Battlescar^Sergra Darkthorn^Conscript of the Horde^^^Follow the western road from Kargal's Far Watch Outpost.^Take this signed recruitment letter to the Crossroads. Sergra Darkthorn
column2: curse her hide
column3: is in charge there. She's a nasty shaman who will talk your head in circles before she lets you do anything useful. Thrall is convinced she's something special
column4: but I'm not so sure. You'll just have to decide for yourself
column5: pup...

column1: Gann's Reclamation^23^Horde^The Barrens^Gann Stonespire^Gann Stonespire^Gann's Reclamation^^^Gann Stonespire wants you to kill 15 Bael'dun Excavators and 5 Bael'dun Foremen.^In solitude I wander these roads. The dwarves of Bael Modan show no respect for my land. Horrendous blasts drive holes deep into the ground as noisy machines rip apart the hills. Lands which once served as home and provider to my tribe are now riddled with destructive dwarves. Attempts at reaching a diplomatic resolution have failed. Now is the time for decisive action. Drive the dwarves from the Bael Modan excavation by force and bring to me the journal of their leader
column2: Prospector Khazgorm.

column1: Plainstrider Menace^12^Horde^The Barrens^Sergra Darkthorn^Sergra Darkthorn^Sergra Darkthorn^^^Collect 7 Plainstrider Beaks and return them to Sergra Darkthorn in the Crossroads.^Your first prey will be easy. The plainstriders to the east have been harassing our food supplies and have become a nuisance. Put down the plainstriders and return to me with their beaks.
The Zhevra^13^Horde^The Barrens^Sergra Darkthorn^Sergra Darkthorn^Sergra Darkthorn^^^Slay Zhevra Runners to collect 4 Zhevra Hooves for Sergra Darkthorn in the Crossroads.^The zhevra
column2: although not the fiercest beast in the Barrens
column3: are a shade tougher than the plainstriders. Don't worry -- we'll send you against bigger prey in good time
column4: but for now your teeth could use a little more cutting. Hunt the zhevra to the north and south
column5: and collect their hooves. Bring them to me and perhaps we'll next send you against something tougher.

column1: Revenge of Gann^26^Horde^The Barrens^Gann Stonespire^Gann Stonespire^Gann's Reclamation^^^Gann Stonespire wants you to bring him 6 vials of Nitroglycerin
column2: 6 bundles of Wood Pulp
column3: and 6 samples of Sodium Nitrate.^It is clear the prospector depended on explosives and those noisy vehicles to rip the ground apart. We can expect a new foreman to take over soon. I want to give the dwarves a taste of their own medicine. According to these plans if we combine nitroglycerin with wood pulp and sodium nitrate we can create an explosive charge. The rifleman
column4: soldiers and officers in the Keep are known to have the supplies. Collect these items and bring them to me. I will fashion a charge that the dwarves won't forget!

column1: Guile of the Raptor^37^Horde^Arathi Highlands^Gor'mul^Tor'gan^^Guile of the Raptor^^Speak with Tor'gan at Hammerfall in Arathi Highlands.^This... this power.... Is this the power of the shamans that Tor'gan tried to show me? I must say
column2: it is interesting. Tell Tor'gan that he has convinced me... for the time being. I will listen to what he has to say.

column1: Fungal Spores^15^Horde^The Barrens^Apothecary Helbrim^Apothecary Helbrim^^^Apothecary Zamah^Bring 4 Fungal Spores to Apothecary Helbrim at the Crossroads.^The oases of the Barrens hide a mystery. Life energy flows from their waters
column2: invigorating the plants and beasts that drink it. Invigorating
column3: and altering. There is a mushroom that grows near these oases. Its spores hold properties that we
column4: the apothecaries of Lordaeron
column5: find useful. Bring me these spores and you will earn our gratitude.

column1: Revenge of Gann^26^Horde^The Barrens^Gann Stonespire^Gann Stonespire^Gann's Reclamation^^^Destroy the flying machine at Bael Modan and return to Gann Stonespire.^Following Khazgorm's plans it should be no problem to fashion an explosive charge Ah
column2: there we go. Now
column3: <name>
column4: I am going to entrust you with a special task. Take this explosive stick and use it to blow up the flying machine at Bael Modan. Not only is the flying machine a key part of the site's infrastructure it also serves as a weapon of war. More importantly it is an icon of power and an insult to the memory of my tribe. Make me proud by completing this heroic task and you shall be rewarded.

column1: Kolkar Leaders^16^Horde^The Barrens^Regthar Deathgate^Regthar Deathgate^^^Verog the Dervish^Bring Barak's Head to Regthar Deathgate
column2: west of the Crossroads.^The centaurs have plagued the Tauren for years. And recently
column3: the Kolkar centaurs of the Barrens have grown into a real threat. Normally they were disorganized in these lands
column4: but new leaders have risen among them. Rallying them. To preserve our holdings here
column5: these centaur leaders must be destroyed. Bring me the head of Barak Kodobane. He camps near the Forgotten Pools to the north. Defeat him
column6: then return to me.

column1: Verog the Dervish^18^Horde^The Barrens^Regthar Deathgate^Regthar Deathgate^Verog the Dervish^Kolkar Leaders^^Bring Verog's Head to Regthar Deathgate
column2: west of the Crossroads.^The centaur Verog the Dervish wanders the Barrens
column3: and will be difficult to find. But he is based at the centaur command tent at the Stagnant Oasis to the southeast. It may be possible to draw him to you. Travel to the Stagnant Oasis to the southeast and attack centaur near the command tent. It will be dangerous
column4: but if you can kill enough centaur then they should raise an alarm. And Verog will come. Bring me his head and I will place it with Barak Kodobane's.

column1: Hezrul Bloodmark^19^Horde^The Barrens^Regthar Deathgate^Regthar Deathgate^Verog the Dervish^^Counterattack!^Bring Hezrul's Head to Regthar Deathgate
column2: west of the Crossroads.^Hezrul Bloodmark is the leader of the Kolkar centaurs in the Barrens. He is fierce
column3: brutal and cunning. Defeating him would disrupt and fracture the Kolkars
column4: greatly reducing their threat to us. So kill him. As with Barak and Verog
column5: bring me Hezrul's Head. He leads his people from the Lushwater Oasis
column6: to the south.

column1: Apothecary Zamah^15^Horde^The Barrens^Apothecary Helbrim^Apothecary Zamah^^Fungal Spores^^Bring the Rendered Spores to Apothecary Zamah in Thunder Bluff
column2: before the time limit is up.^I have rendered the spores you gave me into an emulsion. I must now send it to my associate
column3: Apothecary Zamah. If you were to carry this to her
column4: she can offer you something from our stores of alchemical goods. She is in the Pools of Vision
column5: a cave beneath the shamans of Thunder Bluff. The path to this cave is well hidden
column6: but you may find it on the Spirit Rise bluff. Do hurry. This emulsion will maintain its potency for only a short time
column7: and must be resealed and processed before then.

column1: Journey to the Crossroads^12^Tauren^Mulgore^Kirge Sternhorn^Thork^^^^Speak with Thork at the Crossroads in the Barrens.^I have foreseen your arrival
column2: young <class>. Though perhaps you are not so young anymore. I think that it is time for you to move deeper into this land. I can sense that you are destined for great things. It is the Crossroads that you must seek out
column3: for our lives with the orcs have become intertwined and they need assistance. Continue down this road towards the east and follow it north to the Crossroads. Find Thork within its walls
column4: he has the Earthmother's blessing.

column1: Centaur Bracers^14^Horde^The Barrens^Regthar Deathgate^Regthar Deathgate^^^^Bring 15 Centaur Bracers to Regthar Deathgate
column2: west of the Crossroads.^The Kolkar are a threat to the Horde's claims in the Barrens; we must reduce the numbers of their troops. And so
column3: I have a bounty task for you. While in Kolkar territories
column4: slay their warriors and collect centaur bracers. Return when you have a heap of bracers and the Horde will reward you well.

column1: The Tear of the Moons^30^Horde^The Barrens^Feegly the Exiled^Feegly the Exiled^^^^Feegly the Exiled wants you to retrieve for him the Tear of the Moons.^The power was mine! In my very hands! And I want it back! Back I say! Those dirty excavators uncovered it... so beautiful it was. Deemed the Tear of the Moons
column2: it was the first great discovery we made at Bael Modan. It should have been mine! Mine I say! General Twinbraid grew jealous of the power it gave me. He locked it away in the Keep. Called it cursed
column3: he did! The fool! Others wanted it and they had to be stopped! That fiend Twinbraid drove me off. Now I want it back. Back I say!

column1: Ignition^18^All^The Barrens^Wizzlecrank's Shredder^Wizzlecrank's Shredder^^^The Escape^Get the Ignition Key and bring it to Wizzlecrank.^I don't suppose Sputtervalve sent you? I'm in a bind here. I hopped in without realizing that I need a key to unlock the shredder's movement column. One of the other shredder operators asked me if everything was okay
column2: and I panicked! Instead of telling him that I was missing my key
column3: I told him there was some sort of mechanical problem. We need to get out of here on the double! Go up to the control room at the top of the derrick
column4: the supervisor should have a key for this shredder. Help me out here!

column1: Sergra Darkthorn^10^Horde^The Barrens^Melor Stonehoof^Sergra Darkthorn^Sergra Darkthorn^The Hunter's Way^^Speak with Sergra Darkthorn at the Crossroads in the Barrens.^If you wish to walk the hunter's path
column2: then your journey leads to the Barrens. Its beasts are strong-willed and fierce. You will learn much by hunting there
column3: and your spirit will grow. Speak with Sergra Darkthorn. She will be your first guide in the Barrens. Sergra is at the Crossroads. To reach her
column4: travel east from Bloodhoof Village into the Barrens
column5: then north as the road forks. And have care as you travel--the Barrens holds great danger for the unprepared and unwary.

column1: The Hunter's Way^10^Horde^Mulgore^Skorn Whitecloud^Melor Stonehoof^^^Sergra Darkthorn^Bring 4 Flatland Prowler Claws to Melor Stonehoof in Thunder Bluff.^You are eager to explore
column2: I can tell. I too had the lust to wander
column3: once... Wander
column4: and hunt. For hunting is a Tauren's greatest honor. If you truly wish to follow the ways of the hunter
column5: then Melor Stonehoof can show you the path. He is in Thunder Bluff
column6: on the Hunter's Rise. And to show him your skill and resolve
column7: bring him the claws of the flatland prowlers of Mulgore. They are tough and cunning -- fitting prey for a young <class> on the hunter's path.

column1: Dig Rat Stew^23^Horde^Cooking^Grub^Grub^^^^Bring 8 Dig Rats to Grub east of the Crossroads.^A <class> like you must get pretty hungry out here in The Barrens. Me
column2: I'm starving all day long. Tell you what
column3: I'll fix you up a nice stew. Just need a few dig rats. Seems those filthy dwarves at Bael Modan are overrun with everyone's favorite feast. Now head on down south to Bael Modan and bring me back some dig rats. You can't call yourself a seasoned adventurer until you've spent some time killing rats! Haw!

column1: The Escape^18^All^The Barrens^Wizzlecrank's Shredder^Sputtervalve^^Ignition^^Protect Wizzlecrank and the stolen goblin shredder on the way to Sputtervalve in Ratchet.^I suppose I'll learn as we go... Couldn't be too hard. Just some buttons here
column2: and a lever or two... Well
column3: are you ready to go?

column1: Return to Apothecary Zinge^46^Horde^Undercity^Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle^Apothecary Zinge^Tanaris Field Sampling^^^Bring the Sealed Field Testing Kit to Apothecary Zinge in the Undercity.^"Here you go
column2: the power source is safely removed and the data is preserved. Well
column3: safe journeys and all that. Hope the nefarious science experiment worked out for you and all." The goblin turns away from you to attend to the demands of the Gadgetzan Water Company. You secure the sealed testing kit for the journey back to the Undercity. Apothecary Zinge waits for you and the sealed field testing kit there.

column1: Raptor Horns^18^All^The Barrens^Mebok Mizzyrix^Mebok Mizzyrix^^^Smart Drinks^Gather 5 Intact Raptor Horns from Sunscale Scytheclaws
column2: and bring them to Mebok Mizzyrix in Ratchet.^The raptors of the Barrens are smarter than raptors in other lands. And I think all that smarts is hiding in their horns! If so
column3: then I could grind their horns into powder and use it to make "smart drinks." I could sell them for a fortune!!! And you can help me. Find me intact raptor horns from sunscale scytheclaws. They roam in the southern Barrens
column4: and in the northern Barrens near the border of Ashenvale Forest.

column1: Root Samples^16^All^Herbalism^Mebok Mizzyrix^Mebok Mizzyrix^^^^Bring 8 Root Samples to Mebok Mizzyrix in Ratchet.^The herbs of the Barrens are not quite like herbs in other lands. Their properties are mostly the same
column2: but the oasis water here alters the plants; they are just slightly different. I want to study those differences... to see if they're exploitable! If you are skilled in herbalism
column3: then gather root samples off the herbs you find in the Barrens. Bring back these samples so that I may compare them with herbs from other regions.

column1: Harpy Raiders^15^Horde^The Barrens^Darsok Swiftdagger^Darsok Swiftdagger^Harpy Raiders^^^Collect 8 Witchwing talons.^The blasted harpies have been ravaging our caravan supplies for too long. It's time we slit a few of their throats and diminished their numbers. I've been snooping around their nests and figured out who leads who. The most devastating attack will destroy a good section of their lower chain of command and then we can work our way to the top. I'll start you off slow
column2: take out Witchwing Harpies and Witchwing Roguefeathers in the Northwest and bring me 8 Witchwing talons. That should be a good start...

column1: Egg Hunt^22^Horde^The Barrens^Korran^Korran^^^^Bring 12 Silithid Eggs and the Digging Claw to Korran at the Crossroads.^Hey
column2: <name>. I been sent to the Crossroads to watch over the land and take note of its happenings for my masters in Orgrimmar. One object of my studies are the insect-like creatures found to the south in the Field of Giants. We know little of the creatures
column3: so I be makin' it a point to discover more. They seem to have intelligence to them
column4: more so than any normal animal. Take this digging claw and collect some of the creatures' eggs from their mounds
column5: but be careful: if alerted
column6: they will attack you.

column1: Raptor Thieves^13^Horde^The Barrens^Gazrog^Gazrog^Raptor Thieves^^^Bring 12 Raptor Heads to Gazrog at the Crossroads.^Not long ago
column2: a shipment of silver was stolen from our guard tower. It was meant as payroll to the Crossroads' guards
column3: and we want that silver back. The strange thing is... we caught one of the thieves on the night of the theft. And... it was a raptor! Unbelievable! I don't know what raptors would want with silver. But I don't care -- I want the raptors dead so they won't steal from us again! Hunt raptors in the Barrens. Collect for me their heads!

column1: The Forgotten Pools^13^Horde^The Barrens^Tonga Runetotem^Tonga Runetotem^The Barrens Oases^^^Report back to Tonga Runetotem with your findings.^Long ago
column2: the Barrens was a lush place
column3: teeming with life. But war and cataclysm raged across the land
column4: scorching it and leaving a dry husk. Such is the way of things
column5: and it saddens my heart. But within the past few years
column6: new oases have formed in the Barrens
column7: and life stirs. And deep down
column8: we druids sense a power leaking its way to the surface. We must find its source. Travel to the Forgotten Pools
column9: northwest of the Crossroads. Search its waters for a source of power
column10: then return here.

column1: Disrupt the Attacks^12^Horde^The Barrens^Thork^Thork^^^The Disruption Ends
