column2: Supplies for the Crossroads^Of the Razormane tribe
column3: kill 8 Water Seekers
column4: 8 Thornweavers and 3 Hunters
column5: and then return to Thork in the Crossroads.^All the quilboars are our enemies
column6: <name>. Some just prove to be more of a nuisance than others. The Razormane tribe has been attacking our supply lines from Durotar
column7: causing us no end of annoyance. I have scouts seeking the leader of these raids
column8: but until then
column9: any losses you can inflict on the filthy pig men would aid us. Start in the northeast towards Durotar. You can always tell their dens from the huge thorny vines that come up from the earth. Seek them out
column10: and slay them.

column1: The Disruption Ends^15^Horde^The Barrens^Thork^Thork^^Disrupt the Attacks^^Kill 8 Razormane Geomancers
column2: 8 Razormane Defenders
column3: and Kreenig Snarlsnout.^One of my scouts witnessed an attack on a caravan from Durotar
column4: <name>. The culprits are indeed the Razormane tribe of quilboars. One of the quilboars in particular is leading the raids: Kreenig Snarlsnout. He was seen northeast of here
column5: just south of the road from Durotar. If the threat is to be ended
column6: then Kreenig must die. To be sure the attacks cease
column7: though
column8: I say we add insult to their injury. Kill Kreenig along with more of their tribe
column9: and return to me when you have his tusk.

column1: Isha Awak^27^Horde^The Barrens^Mahren Skyseer^Mahren Skyseer^Sergra Darkthorn^^^Bring the Heart of Isha Awak to Mahren Skyseer.^The grand Isha Awak is lord of these waters. Great is his strength
column2: and solemn his pride. The humans on the coast fear him
column3: for he has consumed many of their number. But I do not fear him. I am grateful he is here. He is a worthy challenge
column4: and honorable prey. If you are ready
column5: then swim out and search for Isha Awak
column6: the Deep Doom. His spirit dwells in his heart
column7: and to hear its beat is to know your fate.

column1: Mahren Skyseer^27^Horde^The Barrens^Jorn Skyseer^Mahren Skyseer^Sergra Darkthorn^^^Speak with Mahren Skyseer.^You have hunted the beasts of the Barrens. Your spirit is strong. But a hunter must always be prepared. A true hunter can stalk prey down any path. Mountains and swamps will not sway <him/her>. Not even the sea. Find my sister
column2: Mahren. She hunts the great water beasts along the coast. She will be your teacher in their ways. But be wary in your search for her
column3: for the Barrens' coast is held by humans.

column1: Harpy Lieutenants^16^Horde^The Barrens^Darsok Swiftdagger^Darsok Swiftdagger^Harpy Raiders^^^Collect 6 Harpy Lieutenant Rings from Witchwing Slayers and return them to Darsok Swiftdagger at the Crossroads.^Hahaha
column2: <name>. Back for more? Good
column3: I like to hear that. This time I want you to assassinate some of the harpy lieutenants in the Dry Hills. Only Witchwing Slayers can be lieutenants
column4: and you can tell them apart by the rings they carry. They are a nasty bunch
column5: but they lead some of the underlings in that area. Taking out 6 of them will be a decisive strike against their matriarchy. Make sure they die painfully
column6: <name>. We want those harpy wenches to know the idiocy of picking fights with the Horde.

column1: Serena Bloodfeather^20^Horde^The Barrens^Darsok Swiftdagger^Darsok Swiftdagger^Harpy Raiders^^Letter to Jin'Zil^Slay Serena Bloodfeather and return her head to Darsok Swiftdagger at the Crossroads.^You did so well with the lieutenants and underlings that I'd like you to do one last thing for me. Serena Bloodfeather is the sister of a harpy named Bloodfeather who was slain by Rexxar quite a while ago. Apparently
column2: these attacks on the Horde caravans are revenge for her sister's death. I need you to slit her throat and bring me back her head. I want to place it on the next caravan we send out... Give those harpies something to think about.

column1: The Stagnant Oasis^16^Horde^The Barrens^Tonga Runetotem^Tonga Runetotem^The Barrens Oases^^^Return to Tonga at The Crossroads
column2: after investigating the Stagnant Oasis.^Like the one you found at the Forgotten Pools
column3: there may be fissures at the other oases in the Barrens. If so
column4: then perhaps the fissures are the oases' source of life. We must test this. Here
column5: take these seeds. They are dead and infertile
column6: but take them to the Stagnant Oasis to the southeast. If there is a fissure there
column7: then place the seeds within it...and observe.

column1: Tribes at War^21^Horde^The Barrens^Mangletooth^Mangletooth^^^Blood Shards of Agamaggan^Kill 6 Bristleback Water Seekers
column2: 12 Bristleback Thornweavers and 12 Bristleback Geomancers and return to Mangletooth at Camp Taurajo in the Barrens.^You must strike my enemies. You must help Mangletooth and the Razormane by weakening the Bristlebacks. Both tribes are very spiritual--tied to the earth and its power. It gives us strength in all things... especially war. If you want to find out who really causes Thork and the Horde such anguish
column3: then help Mangletooth! You attack the spiritual leaders of the Bristlebacks to the north; weaken them so the Razormanes can defeat them and rule the Barrens.

column1: Betrayal from Within^25^Horde^The Barrens^Mangletooth^Mangletooth^Betrayal from Within^Blood Shards of Agamaggan^^Kill Nak
column2: Kuz
column3: and Lok Orcbane and bring their skulls to Mangletooth at Camp Taurajo in the Barrens.^Three of my tribe came out of the Kraul to lead the raids against the Horde
column4: <race>. They are ruthless and cunning
column5: and if you defeat them
column6: then your Crossroads and even most of the Barrens will learn peace... at least from the Razormane tribe. Nak
column7: Kuz
column8: and Lok Orcbane are the ones you seek. They are far to the south of the Barrens. One is a spell caster
column9: another a tracker
column10: and their leader
column11: the one called Orcbane
column12: a warrior. Kill them
column13: <race>

column1: Altered Beings^16^Horde^The Barrens^Tonga Runetotem^Tonga Runetotem^The Barrens Oases^^Hamuul Runetotem
column2: Mura Runetotem^Bring 8 Altered Snapjaw Shells to Tonga Runetotem at the Crossroads.^Your findings are incredible
column3: <name>. These oases hold properties that must come from an outside source. Or perhaps an inside one. I want to know how these fissures are affecting the beasts who drink from the oases' water. Hunt oasis snapjaws at the Lushwater and Stagnant Oases. Bring me their shells so I may examine them.

column1: Echeyakee^16^Horde^The Barrens^Sergra Darkthorn^Sergra Darkthorn^Sergra Darkthorn^^^Bring Echeyakee's Hide to Sergra Darkthorn at the Crossroads.^Whitemist
column2: Echeyakee in the Tauren tongue
column3: is the king of the savannah cats. He hunts with such stealth
column4: they say he's like a thin
column5: white mist on the earth. And he kills so fast his prey have no time for fear
column6: or pain. The Tauren say he is both mercy and death. You will learn if that's true
column7: for I now set you on the path to hunt Echeyakee. His lair is northeast of the Crossroads
column8: among the bones of giant Kodo Go. Blow this horn when you reach his lair. Blow the horn
column9: and he will come.

column1: Ishamuhale^19^Horde^The Barrens^Jorn Skyseer^Jorn Skyseer^Sergra Darkthorn^^The Ashenvale Hunt^Bring Ishamuhale's Fang to Jorn at Camp Taurajo.^Ishamuhale
column2: Speartooth
column3: is the fiercest sunscale raptor of the Barrens. He does not hunt for sport
column4: nor for food. He hunts because hunting is his passion. He kills because it is his nature to kill. And you will learn of his nature
column5: <name>
column6: for your path now follows the taloned tracks of Ishamuhale. Begin the hunt. Slay his favorite prey
column7: a zhevra
column8: then bring its carcass to the dead tree northwest of Ratchet. Ishamuhale will smell the carcass and be drawn to it. Be ready when he comes.

column1: Lakota'mani^22^Horde^The Barrens^Hoof of Lakota'mani^Jorn Skyseer^^^^Bring the Hoof of Lakota'mani to Jorn at Camp Taurajo.^The Hoof of Lakota'mani is a symbol of the strength of the great kodo.
Owatanka^24^Horde^The Barrens^Owatanka's Tailspike^Jorn Skyseer^^^^Bring Owatanka's Tailspike to Jorn at Camp Taurajo.^When touched
column2: sparks fly from the tailspike of Owatanka.

column1: Washte Pawne^25^Horde^The Barrens^Washte Pawne's Feather^Jorn Skyseer^^^^Bring Washte Pawne's Feather to Jorn Skyseer at Camp Taurajo.^The feather of Washte Pawne is painful to the touch.

The Barrens Oases^10^Horde^The Barrens^Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem^Tonga Runetotem^The Barrens Oases^^^Speak with Tonga Runetotem at the Crossroads in the Barrens.^The druids of Thunder Bluff sense a strange power leaking into the Barrens
column2: east of Mulgore. Tonga Runetotem was sent to discover the source of this power
column3: but we fear he will need aid. Travel to the Barrens and speak with Tonga. He will be at the Crossroads. To reach there
column4: take the road east out of Bloodhoof village. Enter the Barrens
column5: then turn north when the road forks. Continue north and you will find the Crossroads. And do not leave the road
column6: <name>
column7: for the Barrens is a harsh land.

column1: Southsea Freebooters^14^All^The Barrens^Gazlowe^Gazlowe^Southsea Freebooters^^^Kill 12 Southsea Brigands and 6 Southsea Cannoneers for Gazlowe in Ratchet.^I sure wish Vice Admiral Grezzlik did a better job of keeping the seas safe for our trading vessels. With all the gold the trade princes have poured into the Trade Fleets
column2: it ticks me off to see so many pirates running willy-nilly
column3: raiding my ships and stealing my goods! I heard that the Southsea Freebooters have set up a camp just south of here. They've been a real thorn in my side and if Grezzlik won't take care of them
column4: well
column5: maybe you can help me get rid of them.

column1: Stolen Booty^16^All^The Barrens^Gazlowe^Gazlowe^Southsea Freebooters^^^Retrieve the Shipment of Boots and Telescopic Lens for Gazlowe in Ratchet.^While I'd like to recover all my goods
column2: I'm sure that's not possible. Still
column3: there's a few things that I absolutely must have! As you see
column4: my observatory is ready to go
column5: but it needs the smaller of the two lenses. The first arrived by caravan from Durotar
column6: but the second was bound by ship
column7: and never arrived. Also
column8: I never got my boot shipment from Drizzlik in Booty Bay! Head down to the pirate camp and see if you can find them.

column1: The Missing Shipment^14^All^The Barrens^Gazlowe^Wharfmaster Dizzywig^Southsea Freebooters^^^Bring Gazlowe's Ledger to Wharfmaster Dizzywig.^I've been waiting forever for my last shipment of goods from Booty Bay! I'm pretty sure that it must have been stolen by the Freebooters
column2: but just to make sure
column3: will you go down to the dockside and ask Dizzywig if my goods were already put into my warehouse without my knowledge? Here
column4: take my ledger down to Dizzywig and have him double check my inventory records against his logs.

column1: The Guns of Northwatch^20^Horde^The Barrens^Captain Thalo'thas Brightsun^Captain Thalo'thas Brightsun^^^^Captain Thalo'thas Brightsun of Ratchet wants you to collect 10 Theramore Medals and slay Captain Fairmount
column2: Cannoneer Whessan and Cannoneer Smythe.^Yet another ship from my fleet has been lost to those overzealous humans at Northwatch Hold! Those pests must be dealt with. Their paranoia has them in a state of frenzy. Trigger happy
column3: reckless louts are shooting at anything in their sights. Travel south along the Merchant Coast to the Hold and lay siege to their forces. Bring me the medals of their soldiers as proof. And for the love of my fleet
column4: slay Captain Fairmount and her overzealous cannoneers!

column1: The Missing Shipment^14^All^The Barrens^Wharfmaster Dizzywig^Gazlowe^Southsea Freebooters^^^Return Gazlowe's Ledger to Gazlowe in Ratchet.^Everything looks square from my records
column2: <name>. Go on back and tell Gazlowe he's out of luck. I wouldn't be surprised if it was the pirates that nabbed his goodies. Nothing else I can do for him. Oh... though you could tell him that I've got some things from Undermine for him
column3: when he has the time to come pick them up.

column1: Weapons of Choice^24^Horde^The Barrens^Tatternack Steelforge^Tatternack Steelforge^^^A New Ore Sample^Bring a Razormane Backstabber
column2: a Charred Razormane Wand and a Razormane War Shield to Tatternack Steelforge at Camp Taurajo in the Barrens.^The Razormane quilboars to the south
column3: beyond the Field of Giants
column4: have no skilled blacksmiths from what I am told
column5: but they've apparently started to develop sturdier weapons. I'd like to get my hands on a few different types to learn their techniques if possible. If you wish to help bring honor to the Horde
column6: then bring me examples of their weapons. Find me a dagger from their stalkers
column7: a wand from their seers
column8: and a shield from their warfrenzy. That should do nicely!

column1: Samophlange^14^All^The Barrens^Sputtervalve^Control Console^Samophlange^^^Access the control console at the Venture Company research site.^The Venture Company set up a small research facility far to the north of here
column2: southwest of the Sludge Fen. I don't know very much about what they're doing
column3: but did manage to discover that they're experimenting with something called a "samophlange". Now what the heck is a samophlange? Well
column4: whatever it is
column5: I want to examine it
column6: so I need someone to go get it. I obtained a copy of their control system operating manual
column7: you should be able to figure out how to disengage the samophlange from it.

column1: WANTED: Baron Longshore^16^All^The Barrens^WANTED^Gazlowe^^^^Bring the head of Baron Longshore to Gazlowe in Ratchet.^WANTED! Baron Longshore
column2: Captain of the Heedless Captain Longshore of Gilneas leads vessels of the Southsea Freebooters
column3: and is wanted on charges of piracy. Remains must be in identifiable condition! -- Gazlowe

column1: Miner's Fortune^18^All^The Barrens^Wharfmaster Dizzywig^Wharfmaster Dizzywig^^^^Retrieve the Cats Eye Emerald from one of the Venture Co. Overseers or Enforcers for Wharfmaster Dizzywig at Ratchet.^Being Wharfmaster of a busy port like Ratchet
column2: I keep my finger on the pulse of information. I know all about the exchange of goods and money between here and Booty Bay. The latest bit of news I've heard is about the Venture Company's Boulder Lode mine northeast of the Sludge Fen. One of the miners discovered an emerald the size of your fist. I know a few buyers who'd be interested in getting their hands on something like that
column3: and I'd be willing to go half and half on its sale.

column1: The Harvester^24^Horde^The Barrens^Harvester's Head^Jorn Skyseer^^^^Bring the Harvester's Head to Jorn Skyseer.^This strange
column2: insect-like creature looks outside of the natural order
column3: as though it does not belong in the Barrens.

column1: Free From the Hold^20^Horde^The Barrens^Gilthares Firebough^Captain Thalo'thas Brightsun^^^^Safely escort Gilthares Firebough back to Captain Brightsun in Ratchet.^Finally! Someone to rescue me! I can't believe you got past the guards. These zealots from Theramore are out of their minds. They sank our ship and imprisoned me
column2: the only survivor. I was called an enemy and threat to the Alliance. Me! A threat to their great sham of an Alliance? I was a deckhand on a moonshine transport between Ratchet and Booty Bay. Enough talk. Help me get back to Ratchet will you? Let me know when you're ready and we'll make our break.

column1: Consumed by Hatred^20^Horde^The Barrens^Mankrik^Mankrik^^^^Bring 60 Bristleback Quilboar Tusks to Mankrik at the Crossroads.^Perhaps you know the pain of uncertainty
column2: perhaps not
column3: <class>. But know this: I stand here every day
column4: from the sun's rising till its decline
column5: scouring the horizon for more of those monsters. I've killed every pig man I've come across since
column6: but my thirst for their blood is far from quenched. Perhaps instead of heading north to the Crossroads I should have headed to Taurajo. You
column7: <class>--you could help me. Kill them. Kill as many as you can. Bring me their tusks
column8: and we will celebrate their deaths together.

column1: Samophlange^14^All^The Barrens^Control Console^Control Console^Samophlange^^^Close off the Fuel Control Valve
column2: the Regulator Valve and the Main Control Valve then use the control console again.^The three control valves are currently opened. The various readings on the control panel lead you to presume that they must be shut off before the apparatus can be shut off.

column1: Samophlange^14^All^The Barrens^Control Console^Control Console^Samophlange^^^Get the Console Key from Tinkerer Sniggles to use on the control console.^With the apparatus deactivated
column2: the control panel can be opened up and the samophlange removed from the console. With everything else in place
column3: all that is left is to acquire the key to unlock the console.

column1: Samophlange^16^All^The Barrens^Control Console^Sputtervalve^Samophlange^^Wenikee Boltbucket^Return the Samophlange to Sputtervalve in Ratchet.^Pulling open the face of the control console reveals a dense jumble of wires
column2: tubing and other strange mechanical objects--most of which seem to serve no practical purpose. Pushing them aside and digging deeper into the console
column3: you find the samophlange. A tug removes it from its housing.

column1: Prowlers of the Barrens^15^Horde^The Barrens^Sergra Darkthorn^Sergra Darkthorn^Sergra Darkthorn^^^Collect 7 Prowler Claws from Savannah Prowlers for Sergra Darkthorn in the Crossroads.^Now it's time to go after something that really bites. The prowlers of the Barrens are a tough breed. Tough
column2: resourceful
column3: sly... and deadly. You'll find them among the tall grasses. You'll find many to the southwest of the Crossroads. Be wary as you hunt them
column4: <name>
column5: or you may find yourself no longer the predator
column6: but instead the prey.

column1: The Angry Scytheclaws^17^Horde^The Barrens^Sergra Darkthorn^Sergra Darkthorn^Sergra Darkthorn^^^Kill Sunscale raptors and collect their feathers. Use the feathers on the 3 Scytheclaw nests. Return to Sergra Darkthorn in the Crossroads.^Now
column2: <name>
column3: the hunt deepens. Now you must defeat your prey
column4: and then find your way to its lair. Hunt the sunscale raptors to the south. Slay them and remove the feathers they wear. Place the feathers on the scytheclaw nests southwest of the Stagnant Oasis. Show their brethren you do not fear them!

column1: Betrayal from Within^25^Horde^The Barrens^Mangletooth^Thork^Betrayal from Within^^^Bring Lok's Skull to Thork at the Crossroads in the Barrens.^Take Lok's head to Thork in the Crossroads
column2: <race>. He should know what has happened to my tribe without any words--ha
column3: not that he would believe Mangletooth helped in such things. But I am sure he'll reward you for carrying out such a great deed. I will continue to bless you with Agamaggan's power for as long as I remain in this cage
column4: <race>. Until then
column5: farewell.

column1: Enraged Thunder Lizards^18^Horde^The Barrens^Jorn Skyseer^Jorn Skyseer^Sergra Darkthorn^^^Bring 3 Thunder Lizard Blood to Jorn Skyseer at Camp Taurajo.^Now
column2: <name>
column3: you must face the great thunder lizards. So large are the beasts
column4: the ground rumbles as they stomp across the plains. Take care as you fight them
column5: for one false step and you may find yourself beneath their feet. You will find the thunder lizards in the southern Barrens. They are known as Stormsnouts
column6: Stormhides and Thunderheads. Return to me after you have bested them.

column1: Cry of the Thunderhawk^20^Horde^The Barrens^Jorn Skyseer^Jorn Skyseer^Sergra Darkthorn^^^Find and slay a Thunderhawk
column2: return its wings to Jorn Skyseer at Camp Taurajo.^The thunderhawk
column3: <name>
column4: is a fierce beast. It is time for you to face them. You must find where it roams
column5: and bring me its wings as proof of your successful hunt. Do this
column6: and your time with me will near its end.

column1: Leaders of the Fang^22^Horde^Wailing Caverns^Nara Wildmane^Nara Wildmane^Hamuul Runetotem^^^Bring the Gems of Cobrahn
column2: Anacondra
column3: Pythas and Serpentis to Nara Wildmane in Thunder Bluff.^The druids in the Wailing Caverns
column4: the Druids of the Fang
column5: are an aberration. They were part of an order of noble druids whose plan was to heal the Barrens
column6: but now seek to remake that land to match their own
column7: twisted dreams. The Druids of the Fang have four leaders
column8: and each possesses a dream gem. Even now their faces haunt me! Defeat the leaders and bring me their gems
column9: and the Barrens may again know peace. Go
column10: <name>. You will find them lurking deep within the Wailing Caverns.

column1: Webwood Venom^4^All^Teldrassil^Gilshalan Windwalker^Gilshalan Windwalker^Webwood Venom^^^Bring 10 Webwood Venom Sacs to Gilshalan Windwalker at Aldrassil.^I came to Shadowglen to observe the webwood spiders that dwell in the Shadowthread Cave. They are cousin to a much smaller variety of spider; I believe the world tree has had a profound effect on them
column2: and I would like specimens to study to confirm this. First
column3: I would like some of their venom. Gather Webwood venom sacs from the spiders in and around the Shadowthread Cave
column4: to the north. I can then examine them for similarities with their smaller cousin's venom.

column1: Webwood Egg^5^All^Teldrassil^Gilshalan Windwalker^Gilshalan Windwalker^Webwood Venom^^Tenaron's Summons^Bring a Webwood Egg to Gilshalan in Aldrassil.^Now that I have the spiders' venom
column2: I'd like some live specimens to study. Unfortunately
column3: capturing a living
column4: giant spider is more than I can ask of you
column5: young <class>. And a giant spider is more than I could handle myself! But if you can find an unhatched egg
column6: then delivering specimens will be much easier
column7: and I can then arrange for the unhatched spiders to be contained. There must be a nest deep in the Shadowthread Cave. Please
column8: search for an egg in the nest and return it to me.

column1: Timberling Seeds^7^All^Teldrassil^Denalan^Denalan^Timberling Seeds^Denalan's Earth^^Bring 8 Timberling Seeds to Denelan at Lake Al'Ameth.^The timberlings of Teldrassil are elementals of nature. In some ways they reflect the natural order of plants and animals on our great tree. So it is disturbing to see how angry the timberlings have become. I believe it has something to do with the soil. I have been working on different methods of nurturing plants and would like to try them on timberling seeds. Please
column2: can you gather seeds from timberlings around Lake Al'Ameth and bring them to me?

column1: Timberling Sprouts^7^All^Teldrassil^Denalan^Denalan^^Denalan's Earth^^Bring 12 Timberling Sprouts to Denalan at Lake Al'Ameth.^Small timberlings are sprouting around the waters of Lake Al'Ameth. I'm afraid these sprouts are beyond help -- we should try to clear them from the land before they grow large enough to cause trouble. When you're wandering the lake
column2: if you see any timberling sprouts please take them. Help keep our land clean!

column1: Tenaron's Summons^5^All^Teldrassil^Gilshalan Windwalker^Tenaron Stormgrip^Tenaron's Summons^Webwood Egg^^Speak with Tenaron Stormgrip atop Aldrassil in Shadowglen.^<name>
column2: is it? I heard that Tenaron has been asking for you. You'll find him in the highest room atop Aldrassil. We may live long lives
column3: but it's best you not keep him waiting too long.

column1: Crown of the Earth^5^All^Teldrassil^Tenaron Stormgrip^Tenaron Stormgrip^Tenaron's Summons^^Crown of the Earth^Fill the Crystal Phial and bring it back to Tenaron Stormgrip atop Aldrassil.^It is time for you to set out to seek your destiny
column2: <name>. But before you are ready to set out into the world beyond our enchanted forests
column3: there is much you must learn about our recent history. Much has changed with our people since the Battle of Mount Hyjal. Nordrassil lies a pale shadow of what it once was
column4: its power used to defeat Archimonde and drive back the Burning Legion... There is a task you must perform. Go to the moonwell north of Aldrassil and return me a phial of its water.

column1: Rellian Greenspyre^7^All^Teldrassil^Denalan^Rellian Greenspyre^Timberling Seeds^^^Bring a Timberling Seed to Rellian Greenspyre in Darnassus.^<name>
column2: can you take one of the seeds you brought me to my friend
column3: Rellian Greenspyre? He is a druid in Darnassus
column4: and when last we spoke he revealed his interest in my work with the Timberlings. He had some ideas himself
column5: and he will appreciate a specimen seed to work with. Thank you
column6: <name>. You have been a great help to me. I hope that
column7: some day
column8: you will see the fruit of my labors. You will usually find Rellian walking the pathways of the Cenarion Enclave in Darnassus.

column1: Tumors^9^All^Teldrassil^Rellian Greenspyre^Rellian Greenspyre^Timberling Seeds^^Return to Denalan^Bring 5 Mossy Tumors to Rellian Greenspyre in Darnassus.^There is a malevolence growing in the timberlings. We are trying to find the source
column2: but until we do...in order to keep Teldrassil safe we must cut down the timberlings who are beyond help. Those that wander Wellspring Lake in northern Teldrassil are the most tainted. They must be removed! Destroy the Timberlings you find there
column3: and gather the mossy tumors growing upon them. Bring the tumors to me so that they may be burned.

column1: The Demon Seed^14^Horde^Durotar^Ak'Zeloth^Ak'Zeloth^Neeru Fireblade^^^Grab a Flawed Power Stone. Bring it to the Altar of Fire before the stone expires
column2: then return to Ak'Zeloth.^The Demon Seed is a powerful tool for the Burning Legion. It rests in a cave on Dreadmist Peak
column3: above a demonic altar of fire. I have prepared power stones that when placed near the Seed will disrupt its connection to the Legion. Take a stone from the table and bring it to the altar of fire atop Dreadmist Peak. Travel west
column4: then north when the road forks. The Peak will be to your left. The safest climb to the top is on its northern face. And hurry--the stone's power will consume itself in time.

column1: The Moss-twined Heart^12^All^Teldrassil^Moss-twined Heart^Denalan^^^Planting the Heart^Bring the Moss-twined Heart to Denalan at Lake Al'Ameth.^The heart of Blackmoss the Fetid is covered with a dark
column2: oily moss. In fact
column3: the only way to tell this is a heart is from its slow
column4: rhythmic beat... A beat that continues even now. Perhaps Denalan will want to see this heart.

column1: Crown of the Earth^5^All^Teldrassil^Tenaron Stormgrip^Corithras Moonrage^^Crown of the Earth^Crown of the Earth^Bring the Partially Filled Vessel to Corithras Moonrage in Dolanaar.^While there is more I could speak to you of the moonwells and of Teldrassil
column2: I must send you along. Corithras Moonrage will be expecting you. I have poured the phial of water you brought to me into this vessel to bring to him. Seek out Corithras. You will find him at the moonwell in Dolanaar. Follow the road south from Aldrassil out of Shadowglen
column3: and continue to follow the cobblestones as the road turns west. Mind you stay on the road though
column4: <name>. There are dangerous beasts in the forests of late.

column1: Crown of the Earth^5^All^Teldrassil^Corithras Moonrage^Corithras Moonrage^Crown of the Earth^Crown of the Earth^^Fill the Jade Phial and bring it back to Corithras Moonrage in Dolanaar.^First
column2: let me tell you more of the task you must complete. The druids in Darnassus use the water of the moonwells of Teldrassil
column3: and their moonwell must be replenished from time to time. Using these specially crafted phials
column4: you can collect the water of the moonwells. Take this vessel to the moonwell outside of Starbreeze Village to the east
column5: and fill it with some of its waters
column6: then return to me. When you have completed your task
column7: I shall continue the story where Tenaron left off...

column1: The Glowing Fruit^10^Alliance^Teldrassil^Strange Fruited Plant^Denalan^^^^Bring the glowing fruit to Denalan at Lake Al'Ameth.^Hanging from beneath its fronds of this glowing plant is a large
column2: round fruit. Denalan would want to study this fruit
column3: you are certain.

column1: The Shimmering Frond^10^All^Teldrassil^Strange Fronded Plant^Denalan^^^The Sprouted Fronds^Bring a Shimmering Frond to Denalan at Lake Al'Ameth^The fronds on this plant shimmer in the forest light
column2: giving it a twisting
column3: pulsing aura. You believe that Denalan would want a specimen of this.

column1: Twisted Hatred^7^All^Teldrassil^Tallonkai Swiftroot^Tallonkai Swiftroot^^^^Kill Lord Melenas and bring his head to Tallonkai Swiftroot in Dolanaar.^I must warn you
column2: <name>
column3: this matter must stay between us. The satyr are enough of an embarrassment to us already
column4: and this one is much too close to home. He is called Lord Melenas. He resides in the nearby cave of Fel Rock where he has gathered a large group of grell warriors. His heart is black as night
column5: and he plots something most foul. You must find him within his nearby cave just to the north of here
column6: and bring me his head.

column1: Crown of the Earth^9^All^Teldrassil^Corithras Moonrage^Corithras Moonrage^Crown of the Earth^^Crown of the Earth^Fill the Tourmaline Phial and bring it back to Corithras Moonrage in Dolanaar.^There is another moonwell southeast of the entrance to Darnassus
column2: on the shores of the Pools of Arlithrien. The Sentinels are having problems patrolling the area because of attacks and the growing ill-temperedness of the Gnarlpine furbolgs. Be wary as you seek out the well
column3: and keep your weapons close at hand.

column1: Crown of the Earth^11^All^Teldrassil^Corithras Moonrage^Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm^Crown of the Earth^^^Bring the Filled Vessel to Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm in Darnassus.^Without the blessings of Alexstrasza the Life-Binder and Nozdormu the Timeless
column2: Teldrassil's growth has not been without flaw. Strange beasts have been reported arising from the very ground of the tree
column3: and crazed furbolgs attack passing travelers. I can only hope that the solution the Arch Druid is looking for will be found quickly. I will pour all the phials you brought into this vessel
column4: for you to deliver to Darnassus. Bring it to Fandral Staghelm
column5: you will find him in the druid grove.

column1: Assisting Arch Druid Runetotem^50^Horde^Orgrimmar^Innkeeper Gryshka^Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem^Assisting Arch Druid Runetotem^^Un'Goro Soil^Speak with Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem in Thunder Bluff.^Excuse me <class>
column2: but I'd like just a moment of your time if possible. The Cenarion Circle in Thunder Bluff is most interested in seasoned adventurers such as yourself to lend them aid in a vital research project. While I do not know the specifics
column3: I can inform you that none other than Hamuul Runetotem is spearheading this research. Please - if you are interested
column4: speak with him directly on the Elder Rise within Thunder Bluff proper.

column1: The Enchanted Glade^11^All^Teldrassil^Sentinel Arynia Cloudsbreak^Sentinel Arynia Cloudsbreak^^^Teldrassil^Acquire 6 Bloodfeather Belts and bring them to Sentinel Arynia Cloudsbreak in the Oracle Glade.^I was dispatched with a small group of Sentinels here to protect the Oracle Tree from the harpies that have made nests all around the glade. Little by little we are trying to push them back. When the Oracle Tree attempted to send a runner to Darnassus with a report
column2: the messenger was attacked and killed by a group of the harpies. If you feel up to the task
column3: go to their nests
column4: slay them
column5: and return their belts to me as proof of your deeds.

column1: Mist^12^All^Teldrassil^Mist^Sentinel Arynia Cloudsbreak^^^^Escort Mist to Sentinel Arynia Cloudsbreak at the moon well near the Oracle Tree.^The sabercat's fur is a distinctive gray color
column2: blending into the surrounding forest. As she lays there
column3: you observe that she is badly wounded
column4: with deep lacerations across her back and stomach. She raises her head and gazes at you
column5: bright intelligence shining in blue eyes. She seems to wish to follow you.

column1: Flute of Xavaric^54^Alliance^Felwood^Flute of Xavaric^Eridan Bluewind^Flute of Xavaric^^^Bring the Flute of Xavaric and 5 Jadefire Felbind samples to Eridan Bluewind in southern Felwood.^You study the simple wooden flute you picked up after defeating Xavaric. The knotted wood feels solid
column2: but it seems as if the spirals and patterns in the surface begin to spin and move as you turn it over in your hands. Suddenly
column3: you feel a sense of dread... You shake your head
column4: sure that your mind is playing tricks on you. It's possible that other satyrs carry clues as to what you have found. Bring your findings to the druid
column5: Eridan Bluewind
column6: that lives in southern Felwood.

column1: Teldrassil^11^All^Teldrassil^Sentinel Arynia Cloudsbreak^Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm^Teldrassil^The Enchanted Glade^^Deliver the Oracle Tree's report to Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm in Darnassus.^The forest whispers of your feats of valor
column2: <name>. As I felt the harpies forced from their nests
column3: a greater calm spread across the forest
column4: its creatures once again feeling safe. I have feared sending another messenger to the Arch Druid
column5: but I know that you will see my message safely to him. Deliver this to him and know that the forest will see you safely along its paths to the forest of stone.

column1: Planting the Heart^12^Alliance^Teldrassil^Denalan^Denalan's Planter^^The Moss-twined Heart^^Plant the Tainted Heart in Denalan's Planter.^I have removed that foul moss from the heart
column2: but it remains tainted... Try placing the heart in my planter. It is filled with a nutritive soil that may cleanse and heal the heart.

column1: The Absent Minded Prospector^20^All^Darkshore^Chief Archaeologist Greywhisker^Archaeologist Flagongut^The Absent Minded Prospector^^^Take the mysterious fossil to Archaeologist Flagongut in Menethil Harbor.^This fossil bears a striking resemblance to one I once saw in Ironforge. An archaeologist by the name of Flagongut brought it to our annual Explorers' League conference. He believed the fossil had a power which could be unlocked somehow. Last I heard Flagongut had holed up in the Deepwater Tavern in Menethil Harbor
column2: awaiting escort to the Whelgar Excavation Site. Seek him out and show him Remtravel's fossil. Perhaps he can reveal the secrets of the past. Good luck findin' your way there!

column1: The Absent Minded Prospector^24^All^Darkshore^Archaeologist Flagongut^Archaeologist Flagongut^The Absent Minded Prospector^^^Archaeologist Flagongut in Menethil Harbor wants you to bring him the Stone of Relu and Flagongut's Fossil.^Prospector Whelgar now holds the original fossil at his site in the Wetlands. When I discovered the Stone of Relu
column2: I believed it to be the key to unlocking the mystery of the fossil. While I traveled on the road to meet Whelgar
column3: I was attacked by raptors and the relic was lost. I don't know which one of the mottled beasts swallowed the relic but if you can retrieve it
column4: I can unleash the power of these artifacts. Bring me both the Stone of Relu
column5: and the original fossil he holds.

column1: The Master's Glaive^17^All^Darkshore^Onu^Scrying Bowl^Cave Mushrooms^^^Gather information
column2: then use the Phial of Scrying to create a Scrying Bowl. Use the bowl to speak with Onu.^It is strange that the naga are here
column3: in Darkshore. But stranger still...are the Twilight's Hammer. That cult worships the old
column4: old lords of the earth. Lords defeated long ago. The Master's Glaive
column5: to the south
column6: is a place where such an old lord fell. Go there and look for more Twilight's Hammer cultists. Take this phial of scrying. Use it to create a scrying bowl after searching the Master's Glaive. Then speak to me through the bowl.

column1: Therylune's Escape^18^All^Darkshore^Therylune^Therysil^^^^Help Therylune escape
column2: then tell Therysil at the Shrine of Aessina in Ashenvale that her sister is safe.^Help! I was wandering around the Master's Glaive
column3: and these dirty cultists surrounded me. Lucky I'm good at hiding!! Can you help me out of here? And I need to send word to my sister Therysil that I'm all right. She's in Ashenvale to the south
column4: at the Shrine of Aessina.

column1: Cave Mushrooms^17^All^Darkshore^Barithras Moonshade^Barithras Moonshade^Cave Mushrooms^^^Bring 5 Scaber Stalks and 1 Death Cap to Barithras Moonshade in Auberdine.^I am devising a potion that requires rare mushrooms
column2: mushrooms that grow only in a certain cave. The cave lies behind Cliffspring Falls
column3: to the east and slightly north along the mountains. I would go there myself
column4: but I was advised by the Grove of the Ancients to stay away from that place. Our venerable allies sense that the cave is the hiding place for a new evil in Darkshore. Please
column5: <name>
column6: gather the mushrooms for me. And while doing so
column7: scout the cave to confirm the Ancients' fears.

column1: Onu^17^All^Darkshore^Barithras Moonshade^Onu^Cave Mushrooms^^^Speak with Onu at the Grove of the Ancients.^Onu
column2: an Ancient of Lore at the Grove of the Ancients
column3: knows of your journey to Cliffwater Falls and wishes to speak with you. The grove lies to the south
column4: nestled near the mountains. The Ancients are patient and wise
column5: <name>. But if Onu seeks your counsel concerning what you saw in the falls
column6: then I fear it is urgent.

column1: The Twilight Camp^17^All^Darkshore^Scrying Bowl^Twilight Tome^Cave Mushrooms^^^Find a clue in the Twilight's Hammer camp at the Master's Glaive.^The Twilight's Hammer's purpose at the Master's Glaive is not known. But it must be dark. Search through their camp at the Glaive... Search for some thing that may teach us their intentions. For we must learn their intentions before a plan is made.

Return to Onu^17^All^Darkshore^Twilight Tome^Onu^Cave Mushrooms^^Mathystra Relics^Bring Onu the recovered Insane Scribbles.^Peering into the Twilight Tome is maddening. Text begins to swim and dance after only a moment's glance
column2: and once beautiful scrollwork twists into grotesque shapes. Tearing away one page of insane scribbles is all that is possible before a swoon overtakes you.

column1: Mathystra Relics^20^All^Darkshore^Onu^Onu^^Return to Onu^^Bring 6 Mathystra Relics to Onu at the Grove of the Ancients.^The parchment you found at the Master's Glaive is a page from an ancient text...written by elves! It is heavily cursed and tainted by the corruption of the Twilight's Hammer
column2: but it seems the cult is using ancient elven magic to bring their old masters back to our world. Travel to the ruins of Mathystra to the northeast
column3: and search for ancient relics among the grass and broken stones. Through their study
column4: we may divine how the Twilight's Hammer intends to exploit the magic of the elves.

column1: Grove of the Ancients^11^All^Darnassus^Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm^Onu^Teldrassil^^^Deliver Fandral's message to Onu in the Grove of the Ancients in Darkshore
column2: south of Auberdine.^If you had enough time to run messages for the Oracle Tree
column3: then I'm sure that I can press you into service to deliver a message to the Grove of the Ancients in Darkshore
column4: due south of Auberdine. You will most likely have to secure transport on a hippogryph
column5: but I have faith enough in you that you can manage that. Take this to Onu
column6: the Ancient of Lore. He has been awaiting word from me
column7: even as I waited for news from the Oracle Glade.

column1: The Fall of Ameth'Aran^12^All^Darkshore^Sentinel Tysha Moonblade^Sentinel Tysha Moonblade^^^^Study the tablets which tell of Ameth'Aran and of its fall
column2: then return to Sentinel Tysha Moonblade in Darkshore.^To the east you will find the ruins of Ameth'Aran. It is now inhabited by the restless spirits of the Highborne that once dwelt within its walls
column3: but once it was a place where the servants of Azshara freely practiced their powerful magics. I was sent to explore the ruins and came across two large tablets
column4: scrawled with the stories of Ameth'Aran and its fall. While I read the runes
column5: I was accosted by the spirits
column6: and fled. Please
column7: if you can
column8: venture to the ruins and decipher the tablets in my place.

column1: Bashal'Aran^12^All^Darkshore^Thundris Windweaver^Asterion^Bashal'Aran^^^Find the source of the strange blue aura in the ruins of Bashal'Aran.^The ruins of Bashal'Aran to the east are overrun with demonic minions. The sprites and satyrs that have taken up residence in the area feed upon the magical energies of the area
column2: their powers growing from continued exposure. Even with that
column3: I have noticed that there is one shrine they will not approach. On the western side of the ruins
column4: atop a small bluff
column5: a strange blue aura permeates... There must be an explanation to the demons' reluctance. I would like you to investigate it.

column1: Bashal'Aran^12^All^Darkshore^Asterion^Asterion^Bashal'Aran^^^Acquire 8 Grell Earrings for Asterion in Bashal'Aran.^If I were to relate the story of my life
column2: I have no doubt it would surpass the limits of your patience. Let us say that mine has been a long and painful life
column3: and this spectral form is perhaps the worst torment of all. I am held here by the means of magic. Though my words may seem disingenuous
column4: I assure you I would be grateful beyond words if you would help me find the means of my imprisonment. A seal binds me
column5: and by examining the earpieces of the sprites and grells
column6: I may find a trace of it.

column1: Bashal'Aran^13^All^Darkshore^Asterion^Asterion^Bashal'Aran^^^Obtain the Ancient Moonstone Seal and bring it to Asterion in Bashal'Aran.^If the grells have come into close contact with the seal that binds my eternal prison
column2: I suspect I know the cause. No doubt the seal has come into the possession of the satyr that lead them. I feel strongly that this must be true
column3: <name>. One of the satyr must surely possess it. If you can obtain it
column4: you would bring me so close to passing the bars of my prison that tears would come to my eyes.

column1: Bashal'Aran^13^All^Darkshore^Asterion^Asterion^Bashal'Aran^^^Destroy the Ancient Moonstone Seal at the ancient flame in Ameth'Aran
column2: then return to Asterion in Bashal'Aran.^It was the craft of one of the most powerful of the Highborne that created the seal that formed my prison. In Ameth'Aran
column3: the ruins to the south that are twin to these
column4: persists even today an ancient flame
column5: blue in color. In this flame this seal could be destroyed. Be wary in the ruins
column6: <name>...

column1: Tools of the Highborne^12^All^Darkshore^Thundris Windweaver^Thundris Windweaver^^^^Retrieve 7 Highborne Relics for Thundris Windweaver in Auberdine.^<class>. A task I would ask of you. Have you seen the ruins of Ameth'Aran? If not
column2: you will find them on the eastern side of the main road
column3: some ways to the south. Once they were the home of many powerful Highborne
column4: now they are a testament to the destruction their dabblings produced. I have been told by the Sentinels that the spirits of the Highborne persist
column5: and that they wield their ancient magical implements. Those relics must be appropriated
column6: so that we might destroy them.

column1: Trouble at the Docks^18^All^Wailing Caverns^Crane Operator Bigglefuzz^Crane Operator Bigglefuzz^^^^Crane Operator Bigglefuzz in Ratchet wants you to retrieve the bottle of 99-Year-Old Port from Mad Magglish who is hiding in the Wailing Caverns.^Oops! Had a little mishap
column2: as you can see! The morning cargo shipment from Booty Bay was huge. Huge I say! Never seen so many crates. Well
column3: I was trying to expedite things so I started unloading a bit more than I could handle. That's when everything came tumbling down. Before I knew what was going on
column4: I saw that menace
column5: Mad Magglish
column6: go running off with a bottle of 99-year-old port. Chased him all the way to Wailing Caverns. No way I was going in there. Maybe you're brave enough to find him?

column1: Serpentbloom^18^Horde^Wailing Caverns^Apothecary Zamah^Apothecary Zamah^^^^Apothecary Zamah in Thunder Bluff wants you to collect 10 Serpentbloom.^The Royal Apothecary Society
column2: based in the great Undercity of Lordaeron
column3: has sent me here for a very specific service
column4: <name>. Perhaps you wish to aid me
column5: and in turn The Dark Lady in our efforts to advance the Forsaken. Recently I studied a rare specimen of flora named Serpentbloom. I believe in greater quantities this herb has great potential. Unfortunately Serpentbloom can only be found in the darkest recesses of the Wailing Caverns
column6: a dangerous cave system located in the Barrens.

column1: For Love Eternal^16^All^Darkshore^Cerellean Whiteclaw^Cerellean Whiteclaw^^^^Free the spirit of Anaya Dawnrunner and bring her pendant back to Cerellean Whiteclaw in Auberdine.^In the aftermath of the battles at the Well of Eternity
column2: I heard that Ameth'Aran had been destroyed
column3: its people dead
column4: including my love
column5: Anaya. I would never have thought
column6: thousands of years later
column7: that memories of Anaya would still haunt my dreams. Wandering the woods of Darkshore in a stupor
column8: I found myself in the ruins of Ameth'Aran... where I saw the haunted spirit of my beloved. She must be freed
column9: but I lack the heart to do it. Her spirit must be destroyed.

column1: Skeletal Fragments^57^Horde^Western Plaguelands^Apothecary Dithers^Apothecary Dithers^Scholomance^^^Bring 15 Skeletal Fragments to Apothecary Dithers at the Bulwark
column2: Western Plaguelands.^The key to Scholomance is called a Skeleton Key. It must be forged from the remains of a skeleton - several actually - and hardened by only the strongest of metals within a suitable mold. A signet of power from a being who naturally can open the portal to Scholomance will make the key ultimately function. First thing's first though
column3: <name>. We'll need skeletal fragments for the key's forging. Skeletons inside Andorhal should yield what we need
column4: but the ones outside the walls might work too.

column1: The Tower of Althalaxx^18^All^Darkshore^Sentinel Elissa Starbreeze^Balthule Shadowstrike^The Tower of Althalaxx^^^Find Balthule Shadowstrike near the Tower of Althalaxx in Darkshore.^Hail
column2: young <race>. I am Elissa Starbreeze
column3: and it is my charge to protect Auberdine from harm. To this end
column4: I sent Balthule Shadowstrike to observe the strange happenings around the Tower of Althalaxx to the northeast. It is past time that he should have returned. I worry that he has encountered some unforeseen danger in the forest. I would be most appreciative if you would find him and see that he is doing well.

column1: The Tower of Althalaxx^18^All^Darkshore^Balthule Shadowstrike^Balthule Shadowstrike^The Tower of Althalaxx^^^Collect 4 Worn Parchments for Balthule Shadowstrike near the Tower of Althalaxx.^A group of warlocks has taken up residence around and inside the tower. I would have returned to Auberdine to report to Elissa earlier
column2: but I was afraid that I might miss something while I was away. Delgren suspected such a company might be gathering at the tower
column3: but did not know why. A few scraps of parchment that the warlocks carry have found their way to my hands
column4: but I need more to complete the puzzle. I warn you not to venture into the tower
column5: however
column6: the warlocks there are much more powerful!

column1: The Tower of Althalaxx^18^All^Darkshore^Balthule Shadowstrike^Delgren the Purifier^The Tower of Althalaxx^^^Deliver Balthule's letter to Delgren the Purifier in Ashenvale Forest.^My master
column2: Delgren the Purifier
column3: is a paladin who has graciously offered his assistance in defending our forests from the forces of the demons and undead. He has taught me much about the Holy Light and the art of battle. Delgren must know of the cult's operations immediately. You will find him far south of here at Maestra's Post in Ashenvale Forest. Be swift
column4: I fear the Dark Strand's threat grows with each passing hour.

column1: The Powers Below^20^All^Darkshore^Book: The Powers Below^Gerrig Bonegrip^^^^Bring the Book: The Powers Below to Gerrig Bonegrip in the Forlorn Cavern
column2: Ironforge.^Although terribly worn and scratched
column3: the title of this book can still be read upon its cover: The Powers Below Inside the book is a listing of unpronounceable names with foreboding titles
column4: methods of worship
column5: and preferred sacrifices...many of which include living
column6: humanoid creatures. On the inside cover of the book are the words: "Bonegrip's Runes and Dooms
column7: The Forlorn Cavern
column8: Ironforge. Proprietor: Gerrig Bonegrip." If Bonegrip sells books like this
column9: perhaps he'll buy this one back.

column1: Luck Be With You^60^All^Winterspring^Witch Doctor Mau'ari^Witch Doctor Mau'ari^Luck Be With You^^^Collect 4 Frostmaul Shards for Witch Doctor Mau'ari in Everlook.^Ah
column2: I can tell just by lookin' at ya -- you be wantin' to make a lucky charm. Mau'ari always knows! To da south. you'll find a canyon
column3: an' giants made a' solid ice. The giants sometimes be carryin' dem
column4: but ya can always gather da shards yerself from da canyon. These shards have a powerful reflective quality. Bring back 4 frostmaul shards
column5: and my lucky charm will be yours.

column1: The Tower of Althalaxx^21^All^Darkshore^Delgren the Purifier^Delgren the Purifier^The Tower of Althalaxx^^The Tower of Althalaxx^Collect a Glowing Soul Gem and return it to Delgren the Purifier at Maestra's Post.^Balthule's letter is dire. This Cult of the Dark Strand is a thorn in my side that must be removed. I have been dealing with some of the Dark Strand scum northeast of here at Ordil'Aran. One of their number possesses a soul gem that I believe holds the secret to the cult's power. Bring it to me
column2: and I will be able to decipher the secrets held within.

column1: Knowledge in the Deeps^23^Alliance^Blackfathom Deeps^Gerrig Bonegrip^Gerrig Bonegrip^^^^Bring the Lorgalis Manuscript to Gerrig Bonegrip in the Forlorn Cavern in Ironforge.^As you might know
column2: I collect lore. Old lore. Powerful lore. Lore that opens doorways
column3: and lore that can awaken Those Who Sleep. There are rumors of an old piece of lore
column4: the Lorgalis Manuscript
column5: at the bottom of Blackfathom Deeps in Ashenvale. That place is the old dwelling of long-dead elves. Elves who held great knowledge before their city fell to ruin. Search Blackfathom Deeps for the manuscript. Do this
column6: and I will not forget it. Not even after ... the end days.

column1: The Tower of Althalaxx^24^All^Darkshore^Delgren the Purifier^Delgren the Purifier^The Tower of Althalaxx^The Tower of Althalaxx^Supplies to Auberdine^Bring Ilkrud Magthrull's Tome to Delgren the Purifier at Maestra's Post.^Ilkrud Magthrull. Yes
column2: I have knowledge of him. He is a powerful orc warlock that makes his residence at the Fire Scar Shrine
column3: a place of great evil in southwestern Ashenvale. He had been little more than an annoyance until now
column4: and I had not dealt with him
column5: but it seems that his time has come.

column1: Finding the Source^55^All^Un'Goro Crater^Krakle^Krakle^Finding the Source^^^Krakle in Un'Goro Crater wants you to find the hottest area of Fire Plume Ridge.^The hot springs here are a source of mystery to me. Where does the heat come from? Looking at how close the pools are to Fire Plume Ridge
column2: I really wonder if the volcano might have something to do with it. I created a thermometer to take readings of the temperatures at the volcano
column3: and I'd like to find the hottest part. It gives the measurements in degrees Kraklenheit! Here
column4: take it
column5: and take readings of the temperatures at the ridge whenever you see a hot spot!

column1: Cache of Mau'ari^60^All^Winterspring^Witch Doctor Mau'ari^Witch Doctor Mau'ari^Luck Be With You^^Frostsaber E'ko
column2: Winterfall E'ko
column3: Shardtooth E'ko
column4: Chillwind E'ko
column5: Ice Thistle E'ko
column6: Frostmaul E'ko
column7: Wildkin E'ko^Speak to Witch Doctor Mau'ari again in a moment to receive the lucky charm.^Now
column8: before I give ya dis charm
column9: I better explain how ta use it. If you carry da charm with ya
column10: you'll find dat certain items will drop from creatures ya fight. If you don't have da charm with you
column11: you won't find them. Understand? You'll know these special items by the name -- they be called E'ko. If you find any of these items
column12: just bring dem to ol' Mau'ari
column13: and she help ya out. Wait here while I fix your charm.

column1: Supplies to Auberdine^24^Alliance^Ashenvale^Feero Ironhand^Delgren the Purifier^^The Tower of Althalaxx^^Speak with Delgren the Purifier at Maestra's Post after seeing Feero safely through Ashenvale Forest.^Delgren has asked me to deliver messages and supplies to Sentinel Starbreeze in Auberdine
column2: but I am loathe to leave on my own. Dangerous foes operate in the forest
column3: and I do not wish to risk letting these supplies and information fall into the wrong hands. If you and others could act as my guards
column4: I could leave now. With your protection
column5: I have no doubt that we can see these goods safely to Auberdine.

column1: Are We There
column2: Yeti?^58^All^Winterspring^Umi Rumplesnicker^Umi Rumplesnicker^Are We There
column3: Yeti?^^^Collect 2 Pristine Yeti Horns for Umi Rumplesnicker in Everlook.^Now that I have what I need to cover the mechanical moving parts
column4: I only need one other thing. Well
column5: actually two. Two horns! The ice thistle patriarchs and matriarchs have the largest horns
column6: so of course
column7: those are the ones I want. That type of yeti inhabits a cave to the southeast. There are plenty of them there; you shouldn't have any problem finding them. Remember
column8: I only want the best looking ones -- no beat up or broken horns
column9: please!

column1: Moontouched Wildkin^55^Alliance^Teldrassil^Erelas Ambersky^Erelas Ambersky^Moontouched Wildkin^Favored of Elune?^^Collect 10 Moontouched Feathers from Winterspring
column2: then return to Erelas Ambersky in Rut'theran Village.^Wildkin feathers from the Hinterlands appear to contain traces of magical qualities. These powers... they don't seem to be wielded by the creatures
column3: it's more like they are simply inherent to the species -- part of their very essence. During my studies
column4: I heard that a large population of wildkin inhabit the snowy lands of Winterspring. Could these creatures have the same powers? Please help me find an answer
column5: <name>. Go to Winterspring and gather feathers that have dropped to the ground
column6: then return to me.

column1: Find Ranshalla^57^Alliance^Winterspring^Erelas Ambersky^Ranshalla^Moontouched Wildkin^^Guardians of the Altar^Find Ranshalla in eastern Winterspring.^Yes
column2: yes
column3: these feathers seem to hold the same magical enchantment that I noticed previously... While I am not certain what we might find
column4: I urge you to continue searching for answers
column5: <name>. A colleague of mine recently traveled into Winterspring to observe the wildkin there
column6: in their own habitat. Why don't you catch up with her and see what she has found?

column1: The New Springs^55^All^Un'Goro Crater^Krakle^Donova Snowden^Finding the Source^^^Travel to Winterspring and speak with Donova Snowden.^Now
column2: I've heard about other hot springs in a place called Winterspring
column3: far to the north of here. The strange thing is
column4: there are no volcanoes anywhere near them. Interesting
column5: I know. Well
column6: if you want to find out more
column7: you should head to Winterspring and speak to a friend of mine. Her name is Donova Snowden
column8: and she is currently staying by the hot springs there. Thanks again for helping me with my thermometer! See you later!

column1: The Tower of Althalaxx^31^All^Darkshore^Balthule Shadowstrike^Delgren the Purifier^The Tower of Althalaxx^^^Talk to Delgren the Purifier at Maestra's Post.^For all the work that you have done
column2: you deserve to be well rewarded. Return to Delgren and tell him that Athrikus Narassin lies stilled by your hand
column3: and the Cult of the Dark Strand is beaten and scattered.

column1: Deep Ocean
column2: Vast Sea^17^All^Darkshore^Gorbold Steelhand^Gorbold Steelhand^^^^Recover the Silver Dawning's Lockbox and the Mist Veil's Lockbox for Gorbold Steelhand in Auberdine. Both items should be found aboard the wreckage of the ships to the north of the village.^Off the coast of Darkshore to our north are two wrecked ships - the Silver Dawning and the Mist Veil. Some time ago
column3: both ships ran afoul of the blasted murlocs as they sailed across the vast sea into Auberdine. They now lie at the bottom of the ocean as trophies for those fiends. Both captains didn't make it out that night
column4: and their logs and other effects are still below in lockboxes. I'd like for you to recover them for us; it would mean a lot to the crew members still around these parts.

column1: Buzzbox 827^10^All^Darkshore^Wizbang Cranktoggle^Buzzbox 827^Buzzbox 827^^^Collect 6 Crawler Legs and place them in Buzzbox 827.^Hey! Help me with my latest invention
column2: the buzzbox. You can talk to people far away! Maybe you've already seen them
column3: they're boxes with levers on them. The only problem is they need constant maintenance. Each one suffers from a different problem
column4: but I made a really smart decision. I placed each one near creatures that have the proper parts to fix that particular machine. Right now Buzzbox 827 is on the fritz. It's just south of Auberdine
column5: real close. It takes 6 Crawler Legs to fix it. I'll pay ya...

column1: How Big a Threat?^14^All^Darkshore^Terenthis^Terenthis^How Big a Threat?^^Thundris Windweaver^Find a corrupt furbolg camp in Darkshore and return to Terenthis in Auberdine.^Some of my brethren were rescued from a corrupt furbolg in Teldrassil
column2: and I've vowed to stop any more atrocities before more of our kind are injured... or worse. I have seen a couple hints of corruption in Darkshore already
column3: but I have yet to find any widespread signs. I think it would be logical if the investigation continued with the furbolgs. Would you find one of their camps
column4: and return to me if you see any signs of corruption?

column1: How Big a Threat?^14^All^Darkshore^Terenthis^Terenthis^How Big a Threat?^^A Lost Master^Kill 8 Blackwood Pathfinders and 5 Windtalkers and return to Terenthis in Auberdine.^You've already proven adept at scouting our enemy
column2: <name>. Do you have what it takes to fight them as well? Not all adventurers prefer straightforward combat to the art of stealth and evasion. If you think you're up for the task
column3: then the furbolg camp south of Auberdine is currently the biggest threat to our people. You'll find some of the Blackwood tribe there. Kill 8 pathfinders and 5 windtalkers
column4: and return to me here.

column1: A Lost Master^20^All^Darkshore^Terenthis^Terenthis^^How Big a Threat?^A Lost Master^Find 5 Fine Moonstalker Pelts and return them to Terenthis in Auberdine.^<name>
column2: your skills have already helped me in my endeavor. Could I impose on you again to help Grimclaw and his master Volcor? In addition
column3: I can craft you a magical cloak that will allow you to walk unhindered by Darkshore's creatures while you look for him. To create the cloak
column4: I'll need five fine moonstalker pelts from a moonstalker sire or matriarch to have enough material. The cats can be found near Wildbend River to the south
column5: or even farther south near Ashenvale.

column1: Trek to Ashenvale^19^Alliance^Ashenvale^Sentinel Selarin^Raene Wolfrunner^^^^Find Raene Wolfrunner in Ashenvale.^<name>
column2: my mistress
column3: Raene Wolfrunner
column4: awaits you in the city of Astranaar within Ashenvale. With your help
column5: perhaps we can at least ease some of the corruption that's taken hold there. Head south from here and stay close to the road--you'll find your way there without issue if you follow those directions.

column1: Raene's Cleansing^19^Alliance^Ashenvale^Raene Wolfrunner^Teronis' Corpse^Raene's Cleansing^^^Find Teronis in Ashenvale.^<name>
column2: a longtime friend of mine is also aiding the Sentinels here in Ashenvale
column3: but he has yet to return. He had leads on finding an item that he thought could slow the furbolg attacks on our people--a rod created by a now-dead
column4: evil wizard. Before he left here
column5: he mentioned seeking out a gem for the rod. He mentioned the gem possibly being hidden at the shrine in Lake Falathim at the base of the mountain to the west. The gem was being held there before it was overrun. Find my friend
column6: <name>
column7: please.

column1: Gadgetzan Water Survey^46^All^Tanaris^Senior Surveyor Fizzledowser^Senior Surveyor Fizzledowser^Gadgetzan Water Survey^^^Use the untapped dowsing widget near the pool of water by Sandsorrow Watch. Once you have collected the sample
column2: return the tapped dowsing widget to Senior Surveyor Fizzledowser in Gadgetzan.^We've got a position open for a temporary junior-grade surveyor in the Gadgetzan Water Company
column3: if you're interested! With the nomads seizing all our wells
column4: we need to exploit more free sources of water! There is water to be had in the desert
column5: but only to those smart enough to survey them first. Take this dowsing widget and tap a sample of the water by the pool near Sandsorrow Watch. It's right in sight of the trolls around there. Bring the tapped widget back to me when you're done!

column1: A Lost Master^20^All^Darkshore^Terenthis^Volcor^^A Lost Master^Escape Through Force
column2: Escape Through Stealth^Find Volcor in Darkshore and give him the Enchanted Moonstalker Cloak.^The cloak is complete
column3: <name>. The time has come to find Volcor. I can only hope we are in time. The cloak's magic
column4: once invoked
column5: will not last long; perhaps five minutes. It will be up to you to know when to use it: I would suggest waiting until you find Grimclaw. If what he has told me is true
column6: you will find his master in a cave south of here. Grimclaw will be alongside the road waiting for you. Signal to him by waving when you see him
column7: and he'll point the way towards his master.

column1: Escape Through Force^22^All^Darkshore^Volcor^Terenthis^^A Lost Master^^Protect Volcor until you reach the road
column2: then speak to Terenthis in Auberdine.^All right
column3: <name>
column4: force it is. Let's get out of here as soon as you're ready. We'll fight our way down to the road--Grimclaw should still be there. Once there
column5: we can part ways. Terenthis will want to hear your version of the story immediately
column6: so head to Auberdine after we make it out of here.

column1: Escape Through Stealth^20^All^Darkshore^Volcor^Terenthis^^A Lost Master^^Escape the Furbolg cave and meet Terenthis in Auberdine.^All right then... if you're sure
column2: we'll sneak out of here. Let us leave when you're ready. Remember
column3: after you've escaped
column4: meet Terenthis back in Auberdine. I'll head there on my own since I'll probably be moving faster than you.

column1: Denalan's Earth^5^All^Teldrassil^Syral Bladeleaf^Denalan^^^Timberling Seeds
column2: Timberling Sprouts^Bring the package of Rare Earth to Denalan at Lake Al'Ameth.^Are you heading to the south? To Lake Al'Ameth? If so
column3: then I have a task I might ask of you... My colleague Denalan has a camp along the eastern end of the lake
column4: where he is studying and experimenting on the plant life of Teldrassil. He requested a package of rare earths from Darnassus and it was late
column5: only recently arriving here in Dolanaar. Can you take the package to him?

column1: The New Frontier^55^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Bluff Runner Windstrider^Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem^The New Frontier^^^Speak with Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem on the Elder Rise of Thunder Bluff about the Cenarion Circle's call to explore the frontiers of Kalimdor.^Attention
column2: heroes! The Cenarion Circle seeks able bodied individuals to assist them in exploring the vast new frontiers of Kalimdor! A forbidden wasteland of unimaginable dangers lies far to the west of Tanaris and Gadgetzan
column3: and the Circle needs willing and honorable proxies to act in their stead. All interested individuals should seek audience with the Cenarion Circle. Speak with the Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem on the Elder's Rise of Thunder Bluff for more information!

column1: Buzzbox 411^12^All^Darkshore^Buzzbox 827^Buzzbox 411^Buzzbox 827^^^Collect 3 Thresher Eyes from Darkshore Threshers in the deep sea near Buzzbox 411.^A tiny voice crackles from deep within the machine. "Wizbang here! The next Buzzbox is north of Auberdine
column2: on the beach So
column3: that Buzzbox is number 411 and it needs 3 Thresher Eyes for its repairs. They're just off the coast! The darkshore threshers... *Hic*... Sorry about that... Just like last time
column4: when you give the Buzzbox the goods
column5: it'll spit out your reward. *Hic*... What? No
column6: I'm fine!"

column1: Buzzbox 323^14^All^Darkshore^Buzzbox 411^Buzzbox 323^Buzzbox 827^^^Collect 6 Moonstalker Fangs and place them in Buzzbox 323.^The Buzzbox gives a burst of static as you hear Wizbang begin to speak. "The next Buzzbox is number 323. Ish north of Auberdine but... where's the ale? Wha? Oh
column2: ish on the road sho ya shouldn't have trouble finding it near the bridge." Wizbang mumbles something incoherent before you hear a loud gulping sound. "Thish one needs Moonstalker Fangs... 6 of 'em."

column1: Buzzbox 525^16^All^Darkshore^Buzzbox 323^Buzzbox 525^Buzzbox 827^^^Collect 4 Grizzled Scalps from Grizzled Thistle Bears to the south of Auberdine and place them in Buzzbox 525.^Over the boiling noises and dripping sounds coming from the machine
column2: you hear Wizbang's wavering voice call out. "Nexsht onesh far south down the road. Shouldn't be hard to find... jusht off to the shide... near a fensh. I think I hid it in shum bushesh... Bushessh. Hehehe... Yesh
column3: Buzzbox 525 takes grizzled scalps from thoshe grizzled thistle bears. Boy thash a mouthful. Grizzshled... Hehehe..." You hear more gulping sounds as the machine cuts out. Then
column4: suddenly
column5: it bursts back to life. "4!"

column1: The New Frontier^55^Horde^Undercity^Harbinger Balthazad^Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem^The New Frontier^^^Speak with Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem on the Elder Rise of Thunder Bluff about the Cenarion Circle's call to explore the frontiers of Kalimdor.^Attention
column2: heroes! The Cenarion Circle seeks able bodied individuals to assist them in exploring the vast new frontiers of Kalimdor! A forbidden wasteland of unimaginable dangers lies far to the west of Tanaris and Gadgetzan
column3: and the Circle needs willing and honorable proxies to act in their stead. All interested individuals should seek audience with the Cenarion Circle. Speak with the Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem on the Elder's Rise of Thunder Bluff for more information!

column1: The Ancient Statuette^20^Alliance^Ashenvale^Talen^Talen^^^Ruuzel^Bring the Ancient Statuette to Talen
column2: in his camp near the Zoram Strand.^I would charge you with a task
column3: <name>. I was on my small vessel
column4: skimming over the submerged ruins of Zoram
column5: when naga attacked me
column6: surging from the water and tearing at me with their claws! I fled
column7: carrying what supplies I could to make this meager camp. But when I reached the shore and ran... my prized possession was lost. Please
column8: <name>
column9: find the site of my ambush
column10: along the coast to the north
column11: and search for an ancient statuette. It is the reason I have braved the dangers of the Zoram Strand.

column1: The Zoram Strand^19^Alliance^Ashenvale^Shindrell Swiftfire^Shindrell Swiftfire^^^Pridewings of Stonetalon^Bring 20 Wrathtail Heads to Shindrell Swiftfire in Astranaar.^There is evil lurking on our northwestern coast
column2: known as the Zoram Strand. It is the resting place of the doomed city of Zoram
column3: destroyed during the Sundering and submerged beneath the seas. It has been lost to the night elves for ages. Lost
column4: and nearly forgotten. Now
column5: the naga have returned
column6: and for what reason we do not know. But reason matters little; we must slay these fiends and throw them back to the depths! Return to me when your mission is complete.

column1: Ruuzel^25^Alliance^Ashenvale^Talen^Talen^^The Ancient Statuette^^Bring the Ring of Zoram to Talen near the Zoram Strand.^I fear the ancient statuette's secrets will remain forever hidden unless you find the key to its ancient lock. That key is a ring
column2: the Ring of Zoram. It belonged to the rulers of this city before the waves of the Sundering drowned it. For years the ring was lost
column3: but the naga have recently found it. Their leader
column4: Ruuzel
column5: dwells on an isle on the northern edge of Zoram. Please
column6: <name>
column7: retrieve the ring for me!

column1: Bathran's Hair^20^Alliance^Ashenvale^Orendil Broadleaf^Orendil Broadleaf^^^Orendil's Cure^Bring 5 Bathran's Hair to Orendil Broadleaf in Ashenvale.^There is a plant that once grew in the old ruins of Bathran's Haunt to the north. The plant was called Bathran's Hair and was known to cure ailments of the spirit. There is a sick child in the village
column2: and I believe it is more than just a physical illness. Will you go to Bathran's Haunt and search it for Bathran's Hair? I may need it to properly treat the child. Bathran's Haunt lies north of Maestra's Post and just south of the border to Darkshore.

column1: Forsaken Diseases^29^Alliance^Ashenvale^Kayneth Stillwind^Kayneth Stillwind^^Kayneth Stillwind^Insane Druids^Bring a Bottle of Disease to Kayneth Stillwind in Forest Song.^The Forsaken
column2: the undead arm of the Horde
column3: have crept into Ashenvale
column4: lurking at our ruins and our barrows. We believe their goal is to spread disease amongst the lands of the night elves. We must confirm this! The Forsaken have a camp south of here
column5: near the Dor'Danil Barrow Den
column6: where they create poisons and diseases and place them in bottles. Fight your way into that camp and steal a bottle of disease. Return with such a bottle. I will test it and find its purpose.

column1: Insane Druids^32^Alliance^Ashenvale^Kayneth Stillwind^Kayneth Stillwind^^Forsaken Diseases^^Kill the druids: Taneel Darkwood
column2: Uthil Mooncall
column3: Mavoris Cloudsbreak; then return to Kayneth Stillwind in Forest Song.^When I struggled with the Forsaken's poisons
column4: I had a vision. I had a vision of the druids in the Dor'danil Barrow Den
column5: poisoned... murdered by the undead! They are now errant ghosts
column6: severed from their bodies and driven mad. So that the druids' spirits might some day find peace
column7: you must enter the Dor'danil Barrow Den and destroy its once great leaders: Taneel Darkwood
column8: Uthil Mooncall and Mavoris Cloudsbreak. Do this
column9: then return to me.

column1: The Book of Ur^26^Horde^Shadowfang Keep^Keeper Bel'dugur^Keeper Bel'dugur^^^^Bring the Book of Ur to Keeper Bel'dugur at the Apothecarium in the Undercity.^<name>
column2: Shadowfang Keep holds a book
column3: the Book of Ur
column4: which would be much prized in my collection. Ur was a great mage of Dalaran before the coming of the Scourge
column5: his studies in other worlds are of much value to ... certain parties among the Forsaken. Enter Shadowfang Keep and find the book. Bring it to me
column6: and I will report your service to our Dark Lady...

column1: Arugal Must Die^27^All^Shadowfang Keep^Dalar Dawnweaver^Dalar Dawnweaver^^^^Kill Arugal and bring his head to Dalar Dawnweaver at the Sepulcher.^Arugal still resides in Shadowfang Keep. We cannot claim Silverpine as a strategic stronghold for the Dark Lady until Arugal is slain. I shall see to it that his magic is eradicated
column2: <name>. But I leave it in your hands to see that Arugal meets the death he so deserves. Travel to Shadowfang Keep and put an end to Arugal's foul spells once and for all. Bring to me the vile wizard's head!

column1: The New Frontier^55^Alliance^Stormwind City^Crier Goodman^Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm^The New Frontier^^^Speak with Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm at the Cenarion Enclave of Darnassus about the Cenarion Circle's call to explore the frontiers of Kalimdor.^Attention
column2: heroes! The Cenarion Circle seeks able bodied individuals to assist them in exploring the vast new frontiers of Kalimdor! A forbidden wasteland of unimaginable dangers lies far to the west of Tanaris and Gadgetzan
column3: and the Circle needs willing and honorable proxies to act in their stead. All interested individuals should seek audience with the Cenarion Circle. Speak with the Arch Druid in Darnassus
column4: Fandral Staghelm
column5: for more information!

column1: Elemental Bracers^24^Alliance^Ashenvale^Sentinel Velene Starstrike^Sentinel Velene Starstrike^Elemental Bracers^^^Collect 5 Intact Elemental Bracers and use the Divining Scroll on them. Afterwards
column2: bring the Divined Scroll to Sentinel Velene Starstrike at the Silverwind Refuge.^Take this divining scroll--it can determine the creator of these elementals. But you will need something from them to use as a reagent to focus scroll's magic--their bracers should do nicely. A few intact bracers from the creatures should be enough. The other bracers will be useless for our purposes
column3: but they may be worth something to a merchant if you wish to sell them. Once you have the intact bracers attempt to use the scroll. Return to me with the results and we shall proceed from there.

column1: Mage Summoner^25^Alliance^Ashenvale^Sentinel Velene Starstrike^Sentinel Velene Starstrike^Elemental Bracers^^^Slay Sarilus Foulborne and bring his head to Sentinel Velene Starstrike in Silverwind Refuge.^There's only one undead mage in the Barrens capable of defiling this many water elementals. He's also the only one foolish enough to try. Sarilus Foulborne is probably sitting at the top of Dreadmist Peak
column2: laughing at me. <name>
column3: you must go into enemy territory and destroy this miscreant. I have had enough of his idiocy and we must show him what happens to those who annoy the Sentinels. Destroy him and bring me his head. Be wary though
column4: the Horde may be watching for you.

column1: The New Frontier^55^Horde^Orgrimmar^Warcaller Gorlach^Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem^The New Frontier^^^Speak with Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem on the Elder Rise of Thunder Bluff about the Cenarion Circle's call to explore the frontiers of Kalimdor.^Attention
column2: heroes! The Cenarion Circle seeks able bodied individuals to assist them in exploring the vast new frontiers of Kalimdor! A forbidden wasteland of unimaginable dangers lies far to the west of Tanaris and Gadgetzan
column3: and the Circle needs willing and honorable proxies to act in their stead. All interested individuals should seek audience with the Cenarion Circle. Speak with the Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem on the Elder's Rise of Thunder Bluff for more information!

column1: The New Frontier^55^Alliance^Ironforge^Courier Hammerfall^Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm^The New Frontier^^^Speak with Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm at the Cenarion Enclave of Darnassus about the Cenarion Circle's call to explore the frontiers of Kalimdor.^Attention
column2: heroes! The Cenarion Circle seeks able bodied individuals to assist them in exploring the vast new frontiers of Kalimdor! A forbidden wasteland of unimaginable dangers lies far to the west of Tanaris and Gadgetzan
column3: and the Circle needs willing and honorable proxies to act in their stead. All interested individuals should seek audience with the Cenarion Circle. Speak with the Arch Druid in Darnassus
column4: Fandral Staghelm
column5: for more information!

column1: Orendil's Cure^20^Alliance^Ashenvale^Orendil Broadleaf^Pelturas Whitemoon^^Bathran's Hair^Elune's Tear^Bring Orendil's Cure to Pelturas Whitemoon in Astranaar.^<name>
column2: I have created a cure that I believe will help the afflicted child. Take it to Astranaar and give it to the child's parent
column3: Pelturas Whitemoon. To reach Astranaar
column4: follow the road south
column5: then east.

column1: Vile Satyr! Dryads in Danger!^32^Alliance^Ashenvale^Illiyana^Anilia^Vile Satyr! Dryads in Danger!^^^Find Anilia in Xavian in Ashenvale.^Listen
column2: I don't know who you are
column3: but I need your help. My sisters went to take back the Branch of Cenarius from the satyr. They said they'd be back soon
column4: but it's been two whole days! <name>
column5: you have to find them! They were looking for the ruins of a night elf temple in Xavian to the northwest. I don't know what to think. Look for Anilia
column6: she was leading them on the search.

column1: The Howling Vale^30^Alliance^Ashenvale^Sentinel Melyria Frostshadow^Sentinel Melyria Frostshadow^The Howling Vale^^^Go to the Howling Vale and study the Tome of Mel'Thandris
column2: then return to Sentinel Melyria Frostshadow at Forest Song.^Though we have put many resources and much effort into driving the remaining demons from the Felwood to the north
column3: our successes have been few. We have been able to keep much of the demonic presence from Ashenvale. To the north
column4: near the Felwood border
column5: the ruined shrine of Mel'Thandris has been overtaken by mysterious wolf-men. Their chilling calls have led the area to be known as the Howling Vale. The Tome of Mel'Thandris kept at the shrine may shed some light on why these wolf-men have come.

column1: Raene's Cleansing^21^Alliance^Ashenvale^Teronis' Corpse^Raene Wolfrunner^Raene's Cleansing^^Raene's Cleansing
column2: An Aggressive Defense^Find the Glowing Gem and return to Raene Wolfrunner in Astranaar with Teronis' Journal.^As you rummage through Teronis' belongings
column3: you find a journal that is still in good condition. You take the journal and leave Teronis' corpse as is. The only thing left to do is find the gem Teronis was seeking. Raene mentioned it being in the area. Perhaps the murlocs have it...
