column1: Raene's Cleansing^21^Alliance^Ashenvale^Raene Wolfrunner^Shael'dryn^Raene's Cleansing^Raene's Cleansing^^Find Shael'dryn at the moonwell to the northeast.^You'll have to do the research yourself
column2: but from what notes Teronis has made
column3: it sounds like your next course of action is to find the other pieces of the rod Dartol created. I would start by heading to the moonwell east of Iris Lake. When you're ready
column4: follow the road and turn north when you reach a small sitting area on your left. A dryad there named Shael'dryn is better suited to guide you. Seek her out. Keep the gem with you--Shael'dryn will need it if she's to help you recreate the rod.

column1: An Aggressive Defense^24^Alliance^Ashenvale^Raene Wolfrunner^Raene Wolfrunner^^Raene's Cleansing^^Kill 1 Den Watcher
column2: 2 Ursas
column3: 10 Totemics
column4: and 12 Warriors of the Foulweald tribe
column5: and then return to Raene Wolfrunner in Astranaar.^Before you travel to the moonwell I have another task that will aid the people of Ashenvale if you would like to test your skills. Along the road heading east before the Falfarren River
column6: furbolgs have been attacking travelers. Their tortured minds feeding upon fear
column7: and their appetites satiated by the blood of innocents. Aid the Sentinels in protecting the lands by showing those monsters the same mercy they have shown our kind. I believe their camps are south of the road... be careful.

column1: Raene's Cleansing^27^Alliance^Ashenvale^Shael'dryn^Shael'dryn^Raene's Cleansing^^^Find the Wooden Key and a piece of Dartol's Rod before returning to Shael'dryn at the moonwell.^I wish your tidings were better. Raene is correct
column2: I know about Dartol's creation and the treants in the area--at least I did once. They've become corrupted now
column3: their nature twisted. If your goal is to find the next piece of the rod
column4: then you'll have to find the key to open the chest it's in. The wooden key is on one of the treants northeast of here
column5: near Felwood. Once you have it
column6: look for a small glade west of the road near the Felwood border... the chest should be hidden around there.

column1: Raene's Cleansing^28^Alliance^Ashenvale^Shael'dryn^Shael'dryn^Raene's Cleansing^^^Find the final piece of Dartol's Rod and return to Shael'dryn at the moonwell.^The final piece of the rod was given to the druids of Dor'danil for safekeeping. I have no idea where they hid it. I'm sorry I can't help you more than that. All I can tell you is to follow the road that leads towards the Barrens. The druids took shelter to the east of that road
column2: but they won't be of much help to you: they were killed recently... it's something I don't like to think about much. When you find the final piece
column3: bring it to me and I will help you reconstruct the rod.

column1: Raene's Cleansing^28^Alliance^Ashenvale^Shael'dryn^Hidden Shrine^Raene's Cleansing^^^Find the hidden shrine and re-enchant Dartol's Rod.^Here is the completed rod
column2: <name>. Reconstructing it was simple... it's finding the shrine that has the power to recharge it that will be the hard part. With some focus and effort it shouldn't be too hard for someone like you
column3: who's already accomplished so much. Head southeast of here--there are very few paths
column4: so be careful--and keep your eyes to the north. The shrine is hidden within the mountains that surround this glade. Once there
column5: place the rod within the shrine... the rest is magic. Hehe.

column1: Raene's Cleansing^28^Alliance^Ashenvale^Shael'dryn^Raene Wolfrunner^Raene's Cleansing^^^Return to Raene Wolfrunner in Astranaar.^I suggest you find Raene and let her know the rod is finished. I'm sure she'll know what your next course should be. Good luck
column2: <name>.

column1: Raene's Cleansing^28^Alliance^Ashenvale^Raene Wolfrunner^Krolg^Raene's Cleansing^^^Find an uncorrupted furbolg
column2: and using the power of Dartol's Rod of Transformation
column3: speak to him.^Alas
column4: I'm not completely certain what he had in mind next. If what he said was true about the rod's power
column5: then it will allow you to take on another form altogether. Which form
column6: I do not know. Perhaps he meant to use its powers to get closer to the tainted furbolgs
column7: but even the uncorrupted creatures would slaughter him were he not careful. Transformed by the rod
column8: Dartol would have to speak to a furbolg who was safe from the effects of Fel Moss. I would start your search southeast of Mystral Lake.

column1: The Branch of Cenarius^32^Alliance^Ashenvale^Anilia^Illiyana^Vile Satyr! Dryads in Danger!^^Satyr Slaying!^Kill Geltharis and return the Branch of Cenarius to Illiyana at Forest Song.^Anilia puts her hands on your shoulders and draws you close. Gasping
column2: she points towards the arch to the north
column3: before her eyes close and her last wheezing breath leaves her body. "He has taken it... Geltharis..." You know in your heart that Anilia's dying wish is to see the Branch of Cenarius back in dryad hands.

column1: Satyr Slaying!^32^Alliance^Ashenvale^Illiyana^Illiyana^^The Branch of Cenarius^^Bring 16 Satyr Horns to Illiyana in Forest Song.^I can't believe that Anilia is gone... We used to play together in the forests all the time. I almost feel... sad. I know something that might make me feel better. Please
column2: slay the satyrs that took Anilia from me! Bring me their horns as proof of your actions and you will forever have my gratitude.

column1: Elune's Tear^22^Alliance^Ashenvale^Pelturas Whitemoon^Pelturas Whitemoon^^Orendil's Cure^The Ruins of Stardust^Bring Elune's Tear to Pelturas in Astranaar.^I had hoped Orendil's cure would save Relara
column2: but I fear it only slowed the disease running through my child. We must find more powerful medicine! Thankfully
column3: Orendil spoke to me of further remedies to try should his first one fail. Elune's Tear is a type of stone that rests in only one place: the isle on Iris Lake
column4: east of Astranaar. Orendil said the stone will wash away corruption... please
column5: <name>
column6: bring me Elune's Tear and pray it will end my child's sickness!

column1: The Ruins of Stardust^23^Alliance^Ashenvale^Pelturas Whitemoon^Pelturas Whitemoon^^Elune's Tear^Fallen Sky Lake^Bring 5 Handfuls of Stardust to Pelturas in Astranaar.^Elune's Tear washed clear some of my daughter's sickness. Her nightmares are lessened and I thank the goddess for her blessing. But ... fever still rages within her. Orendil told me of a frosted dust found among the Ruins of Stardust. Perhaps it will abate Relara's fever. Gather some of the dust
column2: then please return to me. The Ruins of Stardust lie to the south
column3: <name>. May Elune speed your journey.

column1: Fallen Sky Lake^30^Alliance^Ashenvale^Pelturas Whitemoon^Pelturas Whitemoon^^The Ruins of Stardust^^Retrieve a Fallen Moonstone from the Shadethicket Oracle
column2: then bring it to Pelturas in Astranaar.^Relara's fever has passed
column3: but she is still very weak. I do not believe time alone will give her back the strength she has lost. I believe it will take the power of a moonstone. We used to gather moonstones at Fallen Sky Lake to the southeast... until the Shadethickets came. Their leader
column4: a Shadethicket Oracle
column5: gathered up all the fallen moonstones and hoards them. Now
column6: you must retrieve a moonstone from the Oracle. And to do that
column7: I fear that you must slay him.

column1: Avast Ye
column2: Scallywag^60^All^Stranglethorn Vale^"Pretty Boy" Duncan^Fleet Master Firallon^Avast Ye
column3: Scallywag^^^Speak with Fleet Master Firallon aboard the Crimson Vale off the coast of Stranglethorn Vale.^<name>... yeah
column4: I've heard of you. I've heard that you're no friend of Booty Bay - just like us Bloodsail Buccaneers. Fleet Master Firallon is looking for hale and hearty <men /women> just like you for a special mission. If you're interested
column5: head on out to the Crimson Veil and speak with him below decks. She's anchored off the Wild Coast east of here
column6: next to the Riptide and the Damsel's Luck.

column1: Velinde Starsong^30^Alliance^Ashenvale^Sentinel Melyria Frostshadow^Thyn'tel Bladeweaver^The Howling Vale^^^Speak with Thyn'tel Bladeweaver at the Warrior's Terrace in Darnassus.^Velinde Starsong was my predecessor here in Ashenvale Forest. At first it seemed she had the situation in Felwood under control
column2: but little by little her efforts faltered. One day
column3: she simply disappeared. I was sent here to continue her work. I'm afraid I know nothing of the priestess
column4: however. Perhaps Thyn'tel Bladeweaver
column5: one of the commanders of the Sentinels
column6: knows further details of her disappearance that I was not a party to. Surely she will understand the import of such information.

column1: Velinde's Effects^30^Alliance^Ashenvale^Thyn'tel Bladeweaver^Thyn'tel Bladeweaver^The Howling Vale^^^Search through Velinde's chest for her journal
column2: then return it along with the key to Thyn'tel Bladeweaver in Darnassus.^The Tome of Mel'Thandris showed you this? I suppose there would be little harm in allowing you to examine her belongings. This key will allow you to open the chest where we stored her things in the Sentinels' bunkhouse. She kept a journal of her duties
column3: if there is anything to be learned
column4: it will be from that. I should tell you
column5: the Sentinels believe that she had her own reasons for leaving
column6: and expect that she could return at any time. The priestess has done much in the past to earn our trust.

column1: The Barrens Port^30^Alliance^Ashenvale^Thyn'tel Bladeweaver^Wharfmaster Dizzywig^The Howling Vale^^^Speak with Wharfmaster Dizzywig at Ratchet in the Barrens.^Ratchet is the only port in the Barrens. Most likely Velinde found a trading vessel in Ratchet to take her to Blackwater Cove in Azeroth. We've had limited dealings with the goblins that run the port
column2: but the master of the dock should have information about the comings and goings of ship passengers. Follow the road southeast through Ashenvale and you will find yourself in the Barrens. Watch your step
column3: <name>
column4: warriors of the Horde patrol the land. You will be safe at the port
column5: though.

column1: Passage to Booty Bay^30^Alliance^Ashenvale^Wharfmaster Dizzywig^Caravaneer Ruzzgot^The Howling Vale^^^Take a boat to Booty Bay and speak with Caravaneer Ruzzgot.^Ah yes
column2: finally found it. Should have told me she passed through here that long ago. Let's see. Velinde. Booked passage to Booty Bay on the Black Osprey. I don't have anything here saying otherwise
column3: so I'd assume it arrived in port safely. Not much more help I can be to you
column4: but she asked about overland travel over on that side of the world
column5: and I mentioned Ruzzgot
column6: a caravan driver based out of Booty Bay. Might be that this Velinde traveled with him. Move along
column7: now. I haven't all day for you.

column1: The Caravan Road^30^Alliance^Ashenvale^Caravaneer Ruzzgot^Clerk Daltry^The Howling Vale^^^Speak with Clerk Daltry in Darkshire.^Turns out I was wrong about you
column2: and that isn't something that happens everyday. It just so happens that I remember this Velinde you're looking for. Isn't every day that a night elf priestess that wants to travel with a dirty old--but great for your shipping needs!--caravan like my own. We split up on the way north
column3: she was headed for Darkshire. The clerk there keeps all sorts of records. Might know something useful. Be careful in the jungle
column4: it is a deadly place even at the best of times.

column1: The Carevin Family^30^Alliance^Ashenvale^Clerk Daltry^Jonathan Carevin^The Howling Vale^^^Speak with Jonathan Carevin in Darkshire.^No
column2: I don't have any records of a Velinde Starsong staying in Darkshire... though
column3: if you don't mind me saying
column4: I can hardly imagine a night elf priestess taking a room in the inn
column5: if you get my meaning? These wolf-men you mentioned though
column6: that's something I've heard about. Just the other day
column7: Calor came into town with a string of their heads. He works with the Carevin family. Hunters of demons
column8: undead
column9: and other monstrosities. Speak with Jonathan
column10: he's the head of the household.

column1: The Scythe of Elune^30^Alliance^Ashenvale^Jonathan Carevin^Jonathan Carevin^The Howling Vale^^^Look for signs of the Scythe of Elune then return to Jonathan Carevin in Darkshire.^Your story rings true... I do not entirely understand your motives
column2: but if your business here in Duskwood involves ridding the forest of worgen in any number
column3: then I can forgo understanding for results. There is a mine to the south that has been overrun with worgen... They appeared out of nowhere
column4: but from what we know
column5: that is where they first were found. Go about your business
column6: but I would ask that if you find anything of import
column7: you share it with me. We will accept any aid in our war against evil.

column1: Answered Questions^30^Alliance^Ashenvale^Jonathan Carevin^Thyn'tel Bladeweaver^The Howling Vale^^^Return to Thyn'tel Bladeweaver in Darnassus.^We shall rein in the worgen problem
column2: have no worry of that. This evil that your friend introduced to our woods will be contained
column3: and I bear her no ill will for her actions. Strange events are afoot in these times
column4: <name>
column5: and the darkness knows no respite. I will keep you no longer. I suspect that there are others that should hear of what you have found in the mines of Duskwood.

column1: Raene's Cleansing^30^Alliance^Ashenvale^Krolg^Krolg^Raene's Cleansing^^^Kill Ran Bloodtooth
column2: 4 Bloodtooth Guards and collect Ran Bloodtooth's Skull. Return to Krolg near Lake Mystral should you succeed.^The night elves are as old as time
column3: but their arrogance destroys their very world. And now it destroys our lives too. But that can no longer be controlled... I blame the elves for much
column4: but we are still responsible for our actions. Even beyond the corruption
column5: we are capable of great evil. Ran Bloodtooth is one such evil. Power hungry
column6: lusting... the corruption has only made him stronger. My hatred for the elves burns
column7: but I do not wish ill upon their children
column8: so we must police our own.

column1: Raene's Cleansing^30^Alliance^Ashenvale^Krolg^Raene Wolfrunner^Raene's Cleansing^^^Bring Ran Bloodtooth's Skull to Raene Wolfrunner in Astranaar.^Return to your own tribe and let them know of your victory here. Show them your trophy
column2: and bask in the glory...

column1: The New Frontier^55^Alliance^Darnassus^Herald Moonstalker^Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm^The New Frontier^^^Speak with Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm at the Cenarion Enclave of Darnassus about the Cenarion Circle's call to explore the frontiers of Kalimdor.^Attention
column2: heroes! The Cenarion Circle seeks able bodied individuals to assist them in exploring the vast new frontiers of Kalimdor! A forbidden wasteland of unimaginable dangers lies far to the west of Tanaris and Gadgetzan
column3: and the Circle needs willing and honorable proxies to act in their stead. All interested individuals should seek audience with the Cenarion Circle. Speak with the Arch Druid in Darnassus
column4: Fandral Staghelm
column5: for more information!

column1: Compendium of the Fallen^38^Orc
column2: Tauren
column3: ^Scarlet Monastery^Sage Truthseeker^Sage Truthseeker^^^^Retrieve the Compendium of the Fallen from the Monastery in Tirisfal Glades and return to Sage Truthseeker in Thunder Bluff.^The Earthen Ring had pure intentions towards our plagued brethren. But who is to know the motivations of those whispering in the ears of the Elder Council? The Forsaken whom we have allied with have a history wrought with deceit. Too hasty was our pact. Perhaps Cairne would have been wise to heed the warnings from Orgrimmar. Deep within the Scarlet Monastery lies the Compendium of the Fallen
column4: guarded by crazed human zealots. Their method is forged from insanity but their research might prove useful.

column1: Mythology of the Titans^38^Alliance^Scarlet Monastery^Librarian Mae Paledust^Librarian Mae Paledust^^^^Retrieve Mythology of the Titans from the Monastery and bring it to Librarian Mae Paledust in Ironforge.^The future is inevitable! We hurl ourselves towards it like falling raindrops to the Great Sea. But perhaps
column2: by studying the past
column3: we can know what to expect and be better prepared for the unknown. Before dire troubles fell upon Lordaeron
column4: there was a bastion of knowledge tucked away in the Tirisfal Glades. It is rumored that a book called Mythology of the Titans was housed in the library of the old Monastery. Bring it to me and perhaps together we can unlock the secrets of the past!

column1: Vorrel's Revenge^33^Horde^Scarlet Monastery^Vorrel Sengutz^Monika Sengutz^^^^Return Vorrel Sengutz's wedding ring to Monika Sengutz in Tarren Mill.^Even though my will is free
column2: I can serve the Dark Lady no more. I feel my time on Azeroth has come to an end. My life force is shattered. Interrogator Vishas did this to me! Tortured me for weeks! Took my wedding ring and gave it to his wife. The monster! Revenge... I want revenge! The pompous fool bragged about his precious wife
column3: Nancy
column4: who lived along Lake Lordamere. Track the wench down
column5: slay her and return my wedding ring to my wife
column6: Monika in Tarren Mill. Heed my last wishes....

column1: Down the Scarlet Path^40^Alliance^Desolace^Brother Anton^Raleigh the Devout^Brother Anton^^In the Name of the Light^Take Brother Anton's Letter of Commendation to Raleigh the Devout in Southshore.^We of the Scarlet Crusade lay claim to strongholds from Hearthglen to Tirisfal Glades. We are quite proud of our bastions of cleansing throughout Lordaeron. You have proven yourself against the undead in Desolace. But the true threat of the plague lies in Lordaeron. Travel to the town of Southshore
column2: in the Eastern Kingdoms. Seek out a crusader named Raleigh the Devout. Give him this letter of commendation bearing my seal and he will escort you to a place of honor in our Scarlet Monastery.

column1: In the Name of the Light^40^Alliance^Scarlet Monastery^Raleigh the Devout^Raleigh the Devout^^Down the Scarlet Path^^Kill High Inquisitor Whitemane
column2: Scarlet Commander Mograine
column3: Herod
column4: the Scarlet Champion and Houndmaster Loksey and then report back to Raleigh the Devout in Southshore.^I once served the Scarlet Crusade with honor
column5: loyalty and pride. I believed their cause to be a noble one: to rid Azeroth of the undead. But as I spent time at the Monastery in Tirisfal Glades I realized that their grasp on reality was slipping. They now think everyone is plagued who doesn't wear the tabard of the Crusade. Innocent men and women were tortured because they were supposedly plagued. The Scarlet Crusade must be crushed in the name of the Light. You
column6: <name>
column7: must destroy the deranged regime.

column1: Culling the Threat^25^Alliance^Ashenvale^Raene Wolfrunner^Raene Wolfrunner^^^^Bring Dal Bloodclaw's Skull to Raene Wolfrunner in Astranaar.^Directly to the north of Astranaar are the Thistlefur furbolg. My scouts report that their numbers have grown greatly over the past few months. If they grow too great
column2: they may find the courage to attack Astranaar directly. Kill as many of their kind as you can
column3: but bring me their chieftain's skull as proof that their efforts have been stifled... for now. I shall remain here in Astranaar and await word from you. Elune be with you.

column1: Raene's Cleansing^28^Alliance^Ashenvale^Hidden Shrine^Shael'dryn^Raene's Cleansing^^^Return to Shael'dryn at the moonwell.^The rod
column2: now complete
column3: lies in your hands. Shael'dryn will want to hear of your success.

column1: Journey to Stonetalon Peak^18^Alliance^Ashenvale^Faldreas Goeth'Shael^Keeper Albagorm^^^^Travel to Keeper Albagorm on Stonetalon Peak.^The forest spirits tell me you are brave and willing to travel. To the south
column2: not far from Mystral Lake
column3: there lies a tunnel named The Talondeep Path. Through this tunnel you will come to an area known as Windshear Crag in the Stonetalon Mountains. Once there
column4: journey to the southwest past Cragpool Lake and then north
column5: up the steep slope until you reach Stonetalon Peak. There awaits Keeper Albagorm. Heed his bidding
column6: <race>. The journey will be perilous.

column1: Reclaiming the Charred Vale^27^Alliance^Stonetalon Mountains^Keeper Albagorm^Keeper Albagorm^Reclaiming the Charred Vale^^^Keeper Albagorm on Stonetalon Peak wants you to slay 7 Bloodfury Harpies
column2: 7 Bloodfury Ambushers
column3: 7 Bloodfury Slayers and 7 Bloodfury Roguefeathers.^As a protector of the forest spirits you can undoubtedly guess why I am alarmed. You have traveled through these mountains to reach this peak. Surely you have seen the travesty which has befallen the land. Greed has led to the destruction of these sacred hills. The Charred Vale to the south was set afire by the greedy mechanized army of industrialists. Worse yet
column4: the Bloodfuries that have encroached on the land refuse us passage in to begin regrowth. Drive the wretched harpies out
column5: <name>!

column1: Jin'Zil's Forest Magic^26^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Witch Doctor Jin'Zil^Witch Doctor Jin'Zil^^^^Witch Doctor Jin'Zil at Malaka'jin wants 5 portions of Stonetalon Sap
column2: 5 Twilight Whiskers
column3: 30 Courser Eyes and a Fey Dragon Scale.^So excited I am! Three little cages for three little elves! But what shall we do with our lovely tree-hugging friends? Why
column4: let's give them a taste of... what do they call it... forest magic! I'll need a good mess of Stonetalon sap. From those horrid felines
column5: bring me some twilight whiskers. This calls for plenty of courser eyes
column6: of course -- can never have enough eyes. Oh
column7: and lest we forget
column8: a precious scale from a fey dragon. Hurry to Stonetalon Peak
column9: <name>
column10: so I can brew some forest magic!

column1: Reclaiming the Charred Vale^27^Alliance^Stonetalon Mountains^Keeper Albagorm^Falfindel Waywarder^Reclaiming the Charred Vale^^^Travel to Falfindel Waywarder on the border of Thousand Needles and Feralas.^The Bloodfuries have been subdued. But they will regroup soon enough if action is not taken. Far south of the Barrens lies a land known as Thousand Needles. If you travel west in Thousand Needles until you reach the lush forest's edge of Feralas
column2: you will find a druid named Falfindel Waywarder. This great and wise druid is capable of calling forth great forest spirits which can aid in the reclamation of the Charred Vale. Send word of our need! Seek him out at once!

column1: Letter to Jin'Zil^20^Horde^The Barrens^Darsok Swiftdagger^Witch Doctor Jin'Zil^^Serena Bloodfeather^^Deliver Darsok's letter to Jin'Zil within his cave in Malaka'Jin
column2: in Stonetalon.^You've done so well for me
column3: <name>. You're a regular lucky rabbit's foot and there's something I want you to see. The harpies are not from around the Barrens. They come from a place called Stonetalon
column4: far to the northwest of here. Though it is probably a dangerous place for you
column5: I need this letter delivered to an old friend of mine who lives there
column6: a witch doctor by the name of Jin'Zil. He'll be happy to know that Serena Bloodfeather is dead
column7: and I think you'll find Stonetalon an interesting place.

column1: The Spirits of Stonetalon^17^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Zor Lonetree^Seereth Stonebreak^The Spirits of Stonetalon^^^Speak with Seereth Stonebreak at the border of the Stonetalon Mountains and the Barrens.^The spirits of the Stonetalon Mountains are angered
column2: for goblins and their servants are plundering and burning the land. So the land has cried out
column3: and those who listen for such things... have heard. Seereth Stonebreak
column4: a promising shaman of the Horde
column5: was sent to Stonetalon. She reports massive deforestation at the hands of the goblins
column6: and requests aid. Meet Seereth in Stonetalon. To reach her
column7: follow the road west of the Barrens' Crossroads. She is camped near the Greatwood Vale.

column1: Goblin Invaders^19^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Seereth Stonebreak^Seereth Stonebreak^The Spirits of Stonetalon^^The Elder Crone
column2: Shredding Machines^Kill 15 Venture Co. Loggers
column3: then return to Seereth Stonebreak on the border of Stonetalon and the Barrens.^The goblin-run Venture Company moved into the Stonetalon Mountains
column4: chopping down trees and burning huge stretches of forest. The spirits of this place are nearly blind with pain and rage. We must stop the Venture Company! Head northwest
column5: beyond the Greatwood Vale and into the Windshear Crag. You will find the goblins and their servants at work--show them the Horde will not allow the exploitation of Stonetalon. Show them in the language they best understand... Violence.

column1: The Elder Crone^18^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Seereth Stonebreak^Magatha Grimtotem^^Goblin Invaders^Forsaken Aid^Speak with Magatha in Thunder Bluff.^To truly tend the spirits of Stonetalon we must consult the tauren elders. I do not know many of their leaders' names
column2: but I do know of one: Magatha. I have heard that she is very old
column3: and she knows much. If anyone can marshal spiritual aid from the tauren
column4: it is she. Magatha resides in the tauren capital of Thunder Bluff
column5: on Elder Rise -- the city's northeastern bluff. Speak with Magatha
column6: and tell her of the peril of Stonetalon Mountains.

column1: Forsaken Aid^18^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Magatha Grimtotem^Apothecary Zamah^Forsaken Aid^The Elder Crone^^Speak with Apothecary Zamah in the Pools of Vision in Thunder Bluff.^The tauren have a bond with the land
column2: and it pains me to hear of Stonetalon's plight. But I fear that to heal the land
column3: we must first remove the disease upon it. Is it not fortunate
column4: then
column5: that the Forsaken are allied with us? They know much of disease. I believe they can aid us
column6: and by doing so they will strengthen the trust between our people. Speak with Apothecary Zamah. She is a scholar and an emissary of the Forsaken. You will find her in the Pools of Vision below the Spirit Rise.

column1: Journey to Tarren Mill^18^All^Thunder Bluff^Apothecary Zamah^Apothecary Lydon^Forsaken Aid^^^Bring Zamah's Note to Apothecary Lydon in Tarren Mill.^To rid Stonetalon of the Venture Company
column2: we must take extreme measures. Extreme
column3: but without bloodshed. A colleague of mine may have just the tool we need. His name is Lydon; he dwells in the town of Tarren Mill in the Hillsbrad Foothills
column4: in the distant land of Lordaeron. To reach Hillsbrad
column5: travel by zeppelin to our capital
column6: the Undercity. Then go north to Tirisfal Glades
column7: southwest to Silverpine
column8: and south to Hillsbrad. Seek Lydon and bring him this note. It details our needs to him.

column1: Blood of Innocents^23^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Apothecary Lydon^Apothecary Lydon^Forsaken Aid^^Return to Thunder Bluff^Bring 5 Vials of Innocent Blood to Apothecary Lydon in Tarren Mill.^I will create a toxin to bleed the violence from the Venture Company
column2: rendering them weak and docile. That should fix the Horde's problem in Stonetalon
column3: yes? But to create the toxin
column4: I will need the blood of innocents
column5: a difficult ingredient to obtain. Fortunately the Syndicate
column6: a group of human brigands in this area
column7: employ shadow mages... and those mages collect innocent blood for their own
column8: unsavory purposes. You can find the Syndicate shadow mages in Durnholde Keep to the southeast.

column1: Return to Thunder Bluff^23^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Apothecary Lydon^Apothecary Zamah^^Blood of Innocents^The Flying Machine Airport^Bring Lydon's Toxin to Apothecary Zamah in Thunder Bluff.^Here is the toxin. If you use it against the Venture Company it should produce favorable
column2: perhaps even contagious
column3: results. I must say
column4: it is quite exciting to see my work applied in the field! But before using it
column5: take it to Apothecary Zamah. She must create a delivery method for the toxin to maximize its effect.

column1: Shredding Machines^23^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Seereth Stonebreak^Seereth Stonebreak^^Goblin Invaders^^Kill the shredders XT:4 and XT:9
column2: then return to Seereth Stonebreak at the border of the Stonetalon Mountains and the Barrens.^There is a relation to the spiritual magic of shaman and the natural magic of druids. This is why we shaman can hear the plea of the spirits of Stonetalon. Many of their whisperings are lost to me
column3: but one message
column4: one vision
column5: is clear... I saw a vision of two man-shaped machines in Windshear Crag
column6: northwest of Greatwood Vale
column7: felling trees with impossible speed. These metal beasts must be stopped! In my vision
column8: the machines were marked with strange symbols: XT:4 and XT:9.

column1: Deepmoss Spider Eggs^20^All^The Barrens^Mebok Mizzyrix^Mebok Mizzyrix^^^^Bring 15 Deepmoss Eggs to Mebok Mizzyrix in Ratchet.^Spider egg omelettes are a new fad in Booty Bay! The problem is... Booty Bay's got no eggs. I smell an opportunity! In Windshear Crag and Sishir Canyon
column2: in the Stonetalon Mountains to the northwest
column3: lives the deepmoss spider. Bring me its eggs and I'll pay a bundle! In Windshear Crag
column4: the eggs will be clustered under what trees remain. In Sishir Canyon... well
column5: if you have a weak stomach then maybe you should just collect the eggs at Windshear Crag...

column1: On Guard in Stonetalon^21^Alliance^Ashenvale^Sentinel Thenysil^Kaela Shadowspear^On Guard in Stonetalon^^^Find Kaela Shadowspear overlooking the valley entering Windshear Crag in the Stonetalon Mountains.^Hello
column2: <name>. You seem to be full of wanderlust by the looks of you. Have you been to the Stonetalon Mountains? It is a land plagued by the Venture Co. and other enemies of the night elves. Recently
column3: Sentinel Wolfrunner sent my friend Kaela Shadowspear there to investigate what's happening to the land
column4: but I have yet to hear word back from her. I'm even more concerned because the Alliance sent a gnome mage along with her... a sign of trouble for sure. Would you find her and report back to me?

column1: A Gnome's Respite^21^Alliance^Stonetalon Mountains^Gaxim Rustfizzle^Gaxim Rustfizzle^On Guard in Stonetalon^^An Old Colleague
column2: A Scroll from Mauren^Kill 10 Venture Co. Loggers
column3: and 10 Venture Co. Deforesters and return to Gaxim Rustfizzle in Stonetalon.^You see
column4: <name>
column5: I'm a member of the Enlightened Assembly of Arcanology
column6: Alchemy and Engineering Sciences
column7: and it's my goal... nay
column8: my DUTY! to show the night elves that a blend of magic
column9: mixtures
column10: and mechanisms can help save their forests. But it's a hard fought war
column11: and the goblins reproduce like rabbits it seems. I haven't even had time to build my newest inventions! I need some time to plan and organize. But to do that
column12: I need your help keeping the goblins at bay in Windshear Crag to the east...

column1: An Old Colleague^21^Alliance^Stonetalon Mountains^Gaxim Rustfizzle^Lomac Gearstrip^An Old Colleague^A Gnome's Respite^^Speak to Lomac Gearstrip in Ironforge.^The device I'm thinking about is my most advanced version to date. But we'll need a special potion if it's to work. I'm thinking we might as well get the good stuff since this mission could be your last. And for that
column2: we're going to need some potent explosives: Nitromirglyceronium. The only person who can make NG-5 is an old friend of mine: Lomac Gearstrip. Look for him in Tinker Town. You talk him into making us some NG-5
column3: I'll get to work on placement for my devices.

column1: Ineptitude + Chemicals = Fun^21^Alliance^Stonetalon Mountains^Lomac Gearstrip^Lomac Gearstrip^An Old Colleague^^^Bring 4 Minor Mana Potions and 2 Elixirs of Minor Fortitude to Lomac Gearstrip in Ironforge.^Hahaha... you need Nitromirglyceronium to stop goblins from destroying a forest?! I don't care if you know Gaxim or not... I'll give you the stuff just to see you or them explode into itty bitty pieces. There's a problem though: I'm all out. But I'll tell you what
column2: you bring me the correct potions
column3: and I'll make some up for you right away. The least you can do is prove you've got some skill as an alchemist before I just give you a sample of my greatest creation.

column1: Ineptitude + Chemicals = Fun^21^Alliance^Stonetalon Mountains^Lomac Gearstrip^Gaxim Rustfizzle^An Old Colleague^^Covert Ops - Beta^Bring the Nitromirglyceronium back to Gaxim Rustfizzle in Stonetalon.^Here you go
column2: stranger. Take heed with it though... it's volatile stuff. If you're really a friend of Gaxim's
column3: then tell him I say hello. If you're not
column4: then have fun blowin' yerself up.

column1: A Scroll from Mauren^21^Alliance^Stonetalon Mountains^Gaxim Rustfizzle^Collin Mauren^A Scroll from Mauren^A Gnome's Respite^^Find Collin Mauren in Stormwind.^Okay
column2: now for the remote detonation part of my plan... oh
column3: I haven't explained that yet
column4: have I? Okay
column5: so the short of it is this: with a little magic
column6: I can make it so the explosives go off while you're not around. I'm putting together a device that'll allow you to push just one button and have the NG-5 explode when you're ready. But I need a spell from a friend in Stormwind--Collin Mauren is his name. You can find him in the mage quarter there. He's human
column7: so he shouldn't be hard to miss.

column1: Devils in Westfall^21^Alliance^Stonetalon Mountains^Collin Mauren^Collin Mauren^A Scroll from Mauren^^Special Delivery for Gaxim^Bring Dust Devil Debris to Collin Mauren in Stormwind.^Ah
column2: I think I have it. A messaging spell... I believe that's the effect he's looking for. I'll have to create a scroll with the spell impressed upon it. To do that I'll need debris from a dust devil. While I gather the rest of the components
column3: why don't you head to Westfall and find one of the foul creatures? They are dangerous
column4: but I'm sure it's nothing you can't handle if you're willing to subject yourself to one of Gaxim's experiments. I'll be here when you return.

column1: Special Delivery for Gaxim^21^Alliance^Stonetalon Mountains^Collin Mauren^Gaxim Rustfizzle^^Devils in Westfall^Covert Ops - Alpha^Bring the Scroll of Messaging to Gaxim Rustfizzle in Stonetalon.^Here you are
column2: <name>. This should do nicely. Please give my regards to Gaxim when next you see him. I look forward to hearing about this adventure when it sees its completion. Fare well.

column1: Retrieval for Mauren^26^Alliance^Stonetalon Mountains^Collin Mauren^Collin Mauren^^^^Bring 8 Crystalized Scales to Collin Mauren in Stormwind.^Travelers keep asking me about the Stonetalon Mountains. It seems to be a popular place for adventure--it doesn't matter if you're seeking wyvern
column2: elementals
column3: or you have business with the Venture Co. Within the Charred Vale
column4: deep in Stonetalon
column5: there used to be a species of basilisks whose scales
column6: when ground to dust
column7: made a wonderful reagent for some spells I've created. If those basilisks still live
column8: I would love to have a few of their scales. Take your time
column9: it is no rush
column10: but I can pay well.

column1: Covert Ops - Alpha^22^Alliance^Stonetalon Mountains^Gaxim Rustfizzle^Gaxim Rustfizzle^^^Kaela's Update^Retrieve the Venture Co.'s Engineering Plans from the lumber mill in Windshear Crag.^This is it
column2: <name>. Pay close attention. The devices are done
column3: and ready to be used. Take these pages--they'll explain more about the detonators and explosives
column4: and where you should place them. Remember
column5: the success of your mission doesn't depend on how much destruction you cause. Plan Alpha's success depends on you bringing back the Venture Co.'s engineering plans from inside the lumber mill south of Cragpool Lake.

column1: Covert Ops - Beta^22^Alliance^Stonetalon Mountains^Gaxim Rustfizzle^Gaxim Rustfizzle^^^Kaela's Update^Retrieve the Venture Co. Letters from Windshear Mine at the east end of Windshear Crag.^Plan Beta's just like Plan Alpha
column2: <name>. We cause a distraction and then steal their precious letters. The key is to get their letters... remember that. The pages I gave you already will tell you where to plant the explosives. Just get back here alive and with those letters....

column1: Reception from Tyrande^28^Alliance^Stonetalon Mountains^Sentinel Thenysil^Tyrande Whisperwind^Update for Sentinel Thenysil^^^Find Tyrande Whisperwind in Darnassus.^<name>
column2: I am sure Tyrande Whisperwind herself would like to thank you for taking part in this mission. It may not appear so on the surface
column3: but what you've helped start could very well strengthen our foothold in the Stonetalon Mountains. If you consider yourself our ally against these atrocities
column4: go see Tyrande in the Temple of the Moon in Darnassus.

column1: Update for Sentinel Thenysil^22^Alliance^Stonetalon Mountains^Kaela Shadowspear^Sentinel Thenysil^Update for Sentinel Thenysil^Enraged Spirits
column2: Wounded Ancients^^Return to Sentinel Thenysil in Ashenvale.^<name>
column3: you have done a great deed by lending a hand here. The Sentinels of Ashenvale will reward you well if you informed them that Gaxim and I are alive. Tell them we are well on our way to stopping the Venture Co. and healing the lands. Find Tara Thenysil in Astranaar; she will be pleased to see you've returned with good news.

column1: Enraged Spirits^26^Alliance^Stonetalon Mountains^Kaela Shadowspear^Kaela Shadowspear^^Kaela's Update^Update for Sentinel Thenysil^Bring 8 Smoldering Embers from any of the fire elementals in the Charred Vale to Kaela Shadowspear in Stonetalon.^I'm unsure what the Venture Co. did to the Vale
column2: but it's obvious they were overpowered by the creatures there. They set the forest aflame
column3: and used their inventions of destruction to decimate as much of the Vale as possible. But in their ignorance they also released something else: burning spirits
column4: elementals of flame
column5: stone and rage. The land has no chance to see Elune's smile while these creatures roam free. Bring me their smoldering embers to show you've reduced their numbers.

column1: Wounded Ancients^28^Alliance^Stonetalon Mountains^Kaela Shadowspear^Kaela Shadowspear^^Kaela's Update^Update for Sentinel Thenysil^Bring a piece of Corroded Shrapnel to Kaela Shadowspear in Stonetalon.^It seems obvious to me that the protectors of the Vale--the treants--had something to do with the Venture Co. being driven back. Unfortunately
column2: even those once great guardians have now become corrupt. Gaxim thinks their corruption is somehow linked to the weapons the goblins used during their retreat. I told him I'd collect a sample from a wounded treant and allow him to study it in order to figure out if that's true. Bring me some of the shrapnel so the gnome can tell me more...

column1: On Guard in Stonetalon^21^Alliance^Ashenvale^Kaela Shadowspear^Gaxim Rustfizzle^On Guard in Stonetalon^^^Speak to Gaxim in Stonetalon Mountains.^The situation here in Stonetalon is obviously grave for a night elf and gnome to be working together. The Venture Co. has devastated these lands and I've spent most of my time putting an end to the destruction. Do not judge Gaxim prematurely; he understands the need for us to work together. If you wish to aid us
column2: then start by speaking to Gaxim. I'm sorry I cannot send you back to Tara with good news yet. Perhaps soon.

column1: The Flying Machine Airport^23^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Apothecary Zamah^Apothecary Zamah^^Return to Thunder Bluff^^Bring the Toxic Fogger to the Venture Co. sky port
column2: then return to Apothecary Zamah.^The toxin is ready. All that remains is its delivery. You
column3: <name>
column4: must make that delivery. The Venture Company must have a means of sending messages and light cargo between its headquarters and its operations in Stonetalon. It is likely a small sky port -- not big enough for a zeppelin
column5: but perhaps for a flying machine. You must search the areas in Stonetalon under control of the Venture Company and find this sky port
column6: if it exists. If you find it
column7: then place the toxin there. Place it
column8: and run.

column1: Cenarius' Legacy^25^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Braelyn Firehand^Braelyn Firehand^Cenarius' Legacy^^^Kill 4 Sons of Cenarius
column2: 4 Daughters of Cenarius and 4 Cenarion Botanists for Braelyn Firehand near Sun Rock Retreat.^You cannot imagine the hatred I possess for this wretched land. The ilk of Cenarius and the kaldorei druids at the peak employ their pathetic powers to stifle the flow of magic
column3: even so far south of their pathetic holdings... their beloved forests. Would that I could return to Jaedenar and exult in the flow of magic
column4: but my master will not allow me to return until my work is done. I have no doubt you love the night elves and their allies as little as I. Aid me
column5: and both our ends might be satisfied.

column1: Ordanus^29^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Braelyn Firehand^Braelyn Firehand^Cenarius' Legacy^^^Bring Ordanus' head to Braelyn Firehand near Sun Rock Retreat.^They thought that they could halt the flow of magic. They were mistaken. They thought that they could hide Ordanus
column2: but I will have his head! Magic grants me true sight. Yes... there he is. A crossroads... At the top of a great tree in Ashenvale Forest. A name... Raynewood. One of the eldest sons of the forest god. They spirited him away from the peak before I could find him
column3: but his time runs short. Bring it to me and I will share with you a mighty gift.

column1: The Den^29^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Braelyn Firehand^Talon Den Hoard^Cenarius' Legacy^^^Travel to the Den on Stonetalon Peak. Using the Gatekeeper's Key
column2: obtain the druids' hidden items. Use these items to open the Talon Den Hoard.^The druids built the Talon Den on Stonetalon Peak
column3: where they keep many powerful items. They devised a complex scheme to keep them from falling into the wrong hands. Luckily
column4: I managed to... extract some details from one of them. Hidden in a small lantern at the entrance of the Den
column5: you will find the Gatekeeper's Key--with it you will be able to open caches around the Den. The items from these caches will allow you to open their hoard
column6: located in one of the central areas.

column1: Gerenzo's Orders^22^All^Stonetalon Mountains^Piznik^Piznik^Gerenzo's Orders^^^Get the mysterious ore from Piznik after he finishes mining it.^You know
column2: I was once the second most important person here at this site. That all changed when Gerenzo took over. Fired my boss
column3: Ziz Fizziks
column4: and sent me down to work in the mines. Ziz told me to stay here and gather information
column5: though. His new boss will pay us well if we can find out what Gerenzo's plans are. Anyways
column6: what I do know is that Gerenzo has ordered large amounts of this gold-green ore to be mined. I can get you a sample to bring to Ziz
column7: but you'll have to watch for patrols while I get it.

column1: Kaela's Update^22^Alliance^Stonetalon Mountains^Gaxim Rustfizzle^Kaela Shadowspear^^Covert Ops - Alpha
column2: Covert Ops - Beta^Enraged Spirits
column3: Wounded Ancients^Bring the Venture Co. Letters to Kaela Shadowspear in Stonetalon Mountains.^<name>
column4: take these letters to Kaela. I'm sure she'll want to know about this. Or at least the Sentinels will. Make sure you tell her how successful we were and how we couldn't have done it without a little bit of magic.

column1: Gerenzo's Orders^22^All^Stonetalon Mountains^Piznik^Ziz Fizziks^Gerenzo's Orders^^^Deliver the Unidentified Ore to Ziz Fizziks in the Stonetalon Mountains.^I guess I'd better think about getting out of here
column2: also. It won't take long for word of what happened here to spread to the higher ups
column3: and I'm sure they wouldn't take too kindly to meeting me again. I'll sneak out and meet with Ziz. Hopefully
column4: he'll be able to find me a new job! I'll try and clean up this mess a little
column5: but you should take the ore sample to Ziz right away. He told me that he'd set up camp somewhere on the western side of Windshear Crag. Good luck.

column1: Super Reaper 6000^21^All^Stonetalon Mountains^Ziz Fizziks^Ziz Fizziks^Ziz Fizziks^^^Get the Super Reaper 6000 Blueprints for Ziz Fizziks in the Stonetalon Mountains.^Terrible what the Venture Company has done here
column2: eh? What were they thinking? Goblin company hiring a gnome! Lucky for me
column3: Sputtervalve knows a genius when he sees one. Hired me just after I'd been kicked out! Tells me they built some enormous woodcutting machine
column4: and Sput' wants me to steal the plans for him. Unfortunately
column5: Gerenzo--bloody gnome--wants me dead on sight... maybe you could steal the plans for me? You should be able to find them on one of their operators.

column1: Further Instructions^21^All^Stonetalon Mountains^Ziz Fizziks^Sputtervalve^Ziz Fizziks^^^Deliver the Sealed Envelope to Sputtervalve at Ratchet in the Barrens.^This envelope has all the information I was able to snatch as they booted me out the door... Venture Company internal documents
column2: some manuals
column3: technical things... Oh
column4: and of course the Super Reaper 6000 blueprints. Sputtervalve has taken up residence at Ratchet in the Barrens. Shouldn't have much trouble finding him
column5: he's a little green fellow.

column1: Further Instructions^27^All^Stonetalon Mountains^Sputtervalve^Ziz Fizziks^Ziz Fizziks^^^Bring the new orders to Ziz Fizziks in the Stonetalon Mountains.^The matter of this gnome that has been hired by the Venture Company has caused a bit of a stir in Undermine. The trade princes do not approve of Razdunk's consorting with this Gerenzo. Riddlevox has asked me to take care of the problem
column2: and I'm sure he was instructed to do so by one or more of the trade princes. Of course
column3: the Director didn't tell me that. Let's just say I have a hunch. Whatever the case
column4: Gerenzo must be removed
column5: and it would be a fitting test to have Fizziks take care of him.

column1: Gerenzo Wrenchwhistle^27^All^Stonetalon Mountains^Ziz Fizziks^Ziz Fizziks^Ziz Fizziks^^^Bring Gerenzo Wrenchwhistle's Mechanical Arm to Ziz Fizziks in the Stonetalon Mountains.^I met Gerenzo once
column2: but let me tell you
column3: he's not easy on the eyes. His flesh looks like it's rotting away
column4: and he's grafted metal and gears onto his body
column5: replaced some of his limbs with mechanical ones. Northeast of here
column6: far above Cragpool Lake
column7: up near the water wheel is where Gerenzo watches over the entire site. There's no way I could fight my way up there
column8: not to mention take on Gerenzo... But you look like you might be able to make it. If you kill him for me
column9: I'll make it worth your while!

column1: Elmore's Task^15^Alliance^Stormwind City^Verner Osgood^Grimand Elmore^Elmore's Task^^^Speak with Grimand Elmore in Stormwind.^There's a dwarven weaponsmith in Stormwind
column2: Grimand Elmore
column3: who sent word that he needs help with a delivery. I believe he wants a package sent to his homeland in the north. You have a sturdy pair on you! So if you're interested in some legwork then speak with Grimand. We could use you down here
column4: but we must also keep our ties strong with the dwarves. You can find Grimand Elmore at the weapon shop in the Dwarven District of Stormwind
column5: in the northeast section of town.

column1: Deathstalkers in Shadowfang^25^All^Shadowfang Keep^High Executor Hadrec^Deathstalker Vincent^^^^Find the Deathstalker Adamant and Deathstalker Vincent.^In preparation for an assault on Shadowfang
column2: two deathstalkers were sent to the keep to gather intelligence. It has been many days and they have not returned
column3: but we must receive their report if we're to have any hope of a successful attack! So here is your task
column4: <name>. Go to Shadowfang Keep to the south and find the Deathstalkers Adamant and Vincent. Find them
column5: and if they require aid then give it. This mission is as dangerous as is it critical
column6: <name>. Do not fail.

column1: Lonebrow's Journal^27^Alliance^Thousand Needles^Henrig Lonebrow's Journal^Falfindel Waywarder^Lonebrow's Journal^^^Read Henrig Lonebrow's Journal.^You slowly open the weathered journal of Henrig Lonebrow....

The Crone of the Kraul^27^Alliance^Feralas^Falfindel Waywarder^Falfindel Waywarder^Lonebrow's Journal^^^Bring Razorflank's Medallion to Falfindel Waywarder in Thalanaar.^Poor Heralath! And this dwarf... Lonebrow. What a brave soul he was. We must not let their valiance go for naught. This crone... Charlga Razorflank ... must be stopped. Surely
column2: infiltrating the Kraul will be perilous. There isn't time to send word to Darnassus. <name>
column3: assemble a party to slay the crone. Bring me Razorflank's Medallion as proof of demise.

column1: A Vengeful Fate^27^All^Thunder Bluff^Auld Stonespire^Auld Stonespire^^^^Bring Razorflank's Heart to Auld Stonespire in Thunder Bluff.^Cairne is a noble leader for uniting our people here on Thunder Bluff. But I cannot forgive those who drove us from our ancestral lands as easily as some. My people inhabited the southern Barrens for decades. The land was holy to us. But we were driven off by numerous foes. A vengeful fate awaits the crone
column2: Charlga Razorflank
column3: who musters a foul army from within Razorfen Kraul. Bring me Razorflank's heart and I can die in peace
column4: <name>.

column1: Call of Water^20^Horde^Shaman^Tiev Mordune^Tiev Mordune^^^^Bring a Water Sapta to Tiev Mordune in Silverpine Forest if you failed to speak to the Minor Manifestation of Water.^Greetin's
column2: <brotha/sista>! Have you too come to purify the waters here and prove your understandin' to Islen? I've just defeated the corrupt water spirit meself
column3: and I'm just 'bout to put da bracers and remaining drops o' water on the brazier. What's dat? Ahhh. Tiev understan' all too well when somethin' goes wrong. Well
column4: Tiev can help you plenty if you be needin' to see the pure water spirit again. Bring me a water sapta from Islen as proof that you be ready
column5: an' I'll wait to turn in me parts.

column1: Salt Flat Venom^30^All^Thousand Needles^Fizzle Brassbolts^Fizzle Brassbolts^^^Martek the Exiled^Bring 6 Salty Scorpid Venoms to Fizzle Brassbolts in the Shimmering Flats.^I have so many designs for our rocket car! So many! And I must try them all!! I'm working on a new type of fuel. One that burns really really really hot!! I haven't gotten the mixture perfect
column2: but I think I know what I need... The scorpids who wander the Shimmering Flats have a venom with lots and lots of salt in it. It's very unique! And it's just what I need! Bring me venom and trust me -- our car will fly!!

column1: Hardened Shells^30^All^Thousand Needles^Wizzle Brassbolts^Wizzle Brassbolts^^^Encrusted Tail Fins^Bring 9 Hardened Tortoise Shells to Wizzle Brassbolts in the Shimmering Flats.^My brother is working on a new fuel for his rocket car. He's brilliant
column2: he really is. So brilliant that... I think that new fuel he's designing is strong enough to eat right through the car's chassis! I want to reinforce its fuel tanks before that happens. The tortoises out on the flats have very hard shells. I want to use them to create new tanks for our rocket car. Tanks that can hold my brother's new fuel. You look responsible enough. Will you get me those shells?

column1: Martek the Exiled^35^All^Thousand Needles^Fizzle Brassbolts^Martek the Exiled^Martek the Exiled^Salt Flat Venom^^Bring Fizzle's Letter to Martek the Exiled in the Badlands.^I'm developing a new engine that'll make the car go so fast! Fast enough to fly
column2: I know it! I just need to make pistons that can handle very very heavy stress. All my trials have failed because I can't make pistons hard enough! But there is someone who might know how. His name is Martek the Exiled. He is a great smith and knows more about metal than anyone. Take him this letter
column3: I know he can help! But he's far far away -- in Azeroth
column4: in the Badlands
column5: in a camp
column6: with a goblin! Find him!

column1: Encrusted Tail Fins^35^All^Thousand Needles^Wizzle Brassbolts^Wizzle Brassbolts^^Hardened Shells^^Bring 10 Encrusted Tail Fins to Wizzle Brassbolts in the Shimmering Flats.^Our rocket car is the fastest thing on the flats! So fast that ... I'm afraid friction is going to tear it apart! To prevent that I need to create a composite to coat the car's moving parts. It must be hard but not brittle
column2: and must be resistant to salt corrosion
column3: or time spent on the Shimmering Flats will eat it away. Have you heard of the Vile Reef
column4: <name>? It's off the coast of Stranglethorn Vale. Saltscale murlocs live there
column5: and their tail fins are a crucial ingredient of my composite.

column1: Indurium^39^All^Thousand Needles^Martek the Exiled^Martek the Exiled^Martek the Exiled^^News for Fizzle^Bring 10 Indurium Flakes to Martek the Exiled in the Badlands.^I'm not out here just to stay away from people. There is a wealth of metal in the Badlands
column2: <name>
column3: if you have the guts to get it. The metal's called indurium and as luck would have it
column4: it is rumored to possess high resistance to heat and stress. It might work for Fizzle's car. But let's make sure. Get me samples of indurium and I'll test its properties. True indurium ore lies deep in Uldaman
column5: but the Stonevault troggs of the Badlands sometimes have flakes of it on them. Bring me those flakes.

column1: Going
column2: Going
column3: Guano!^26^Horde^Undercity^Master Apothecary Faranell^Master Apothecary Faranell^Going
column4: Going
column5: Guano!^^^Bring 1 pile of Kraul Guano to Master Apothecary Faranell in the Undercity.^As you can see
column6: <name>
column7: we're up to some very.... interesting experiments at the Royal Apothecary Society. As the Master here
column8: it is my job to oversee the most ambitious of our alchemical attempts. So much work and so little time! You look well traveled for a <class>. Perhaps you can aid me. I'm in need of a rare substance. It's foul material; it comes from a rare species of bats only found in the muck-hole known as Razorfen Kraul. Bring to me the guano from the Kraul Bats so we can begin our work...

column1: Rocket Car Parts^31^All^Thousand Needles^Kravel Koalbeard^Kravel Koalbeard^^^^Bring 30 Rocket Car Parts to Kravel Koalbeard in the Shimmering Flats.^Heh heh
column2: with all the races they're running here
column3: it's no surprise that a few mishaps happen along the way. If you look around the Shimmering Flats then you'll see evidence of past crashes -- scraps of rocket car parts are littered everywhere! And those parts are worth money to the gnomes and goblins. They're always looking for more contraptions to slap onto their cars. So go out and get me parts. Bring me a heap and I'll pay you well.

column1: Wharfmaster Dizzywig^36^All^Thousand Needles^Kravel Koalbeard^Wharfmaster Dizzywig^Wharfmaster Dizzywig^^^Bring Kravel's Parts Order to Wharfmaster Dizzywig at Ratchet in the Barrens.^I make it my job to get people what they need
column2: and the gnomes over there need a parts order filled. Their parts were shipped to Ratchet a week ago
column3: but I haven't been able to make the trip. So
column4: are you ready for some legwork? Go to Ratchet and give this parts order to Wharfmaster Dizzywig -- he'll probably be at the docks. Do this for me
column5: and I'll have more jobs for you. Jobs
column6: my friend
column7: with serious profit potential...

column1: Parts for Kravel^36^All^Thousand Needles^Wharfmaster Dizzywig^Kravel Koalbeard^Wharfmaster Dizzywig^^Delivery to the Gnomes^Bring Kravel's Parts to Kravel Koalbeard on the Shimmering Flats in Thousand Needles.^Here's Kravel's package
column2: <name>. And when you deliver it
column3: tell him... if he wants more special orders
column4: then he'll have to pay his tab!

column1: Hearts of Zeal^33^Horde^Scarlet Monastery^Master Apothecary Faranell^Master Apothecary Faranell^Going
column2: Going
column3: Guano!^^^Master Apothecary Faranell in the Undercity wants 20 Hearts of Zeal.^Why do I need a rare type of guano
column4: you might ask. Well
column5: for this experiment I want to see what effect two diametrically opposed chemical substances can have on each other
column6: especially when both are combined with an ever-toxic agent to ensure the most... ghastly results. In the northeastern peaks of Tirisfal Glades lies the Scarlet Monastery. There the crazed disciples of the Scarlet Crusade congregate
column7: both inside and outside the halls. Which you slay matters not
column8: any of them may have the heart I need.

column1: Delivery to the Gnomes^36^All^Thousand Needles^Kravel Koalbeard^Fizzle Brassbolts^^Parts for Kravel^The Rumormonger^Bring the Delicate Car Parts to Fizzle Brassbolts in Shimmering Flats.^Now that I have what I need
column2: give these parts to Fizzle Brassbolts. He's been waiting a long time for them -- I'm sure he won't miss the little piece I removed from his order... And I wouldn't bother mentioning it to him. It was small and worthless. Trust me.

column1: The Rumormonger^36^All^Thousand Needles^Kravel Koalbeard^Krazek^The Rumormonger^Delivery to the Gnomes^^Talk to Krazek at Booty Bay in Stranglethorn Vale.^Now that we've done a service for the gnomes
column2: it's time to do the goblins a favor! I hear that the goblin racer pilot
column3: Nazz Steamboil
column4: didn't always use that name. I wonder why he changed it. I wonder if it's a secret
column5: and... I wonder if he values that secret. If anyone knows the truth
column6: then it's Krazek of Booty Bay
column7: on the southern tip of Stranglethorn. Speak with Krazek and ask him about our goblin pilot. If you can get useful information from him
column8: then we might just turn a profit from it.

column1: Dream Dust in the Swamp^36^All^Swamp of Sorrows^Krazek^Krazek^The Rumormonger^^^Bring 10 Specks of Dream Dust to Krazek in Booty Bay. Dream Dust is gathered from the dragon whelps of the Swamp of Sorrows.^Getting the information on Nazz is quite a favor
column2: <name>. Yes
column3: quite a favor. But you've come all the way from the Shimmering Flats to get it... are you willing to travel some more? While I contact my sources
column4: why don't you gather something for me
column5: eh? Hm... what will it be? How about dream dust
column6: from the dragon whelps of the Swamp of Sorrows. Yes
column7: I'd love some dream dust for my snuff pouch! Get it for me
column8: <name>
column9: and I'll give you the information you seek.

column1: Rumors for Kravel^36^All^Thousand Needles^Krazek^Kravel Koalbeard^The Rumormonger^^Back to Booty Bay^Bring the Goblin Rumors to Kravel Koalbeard on the Shimmering Flats in Thousand Needles.^I had to use some of my favors
column2: and gave away a rare bottle of elven wine
column3: and did some heavy deducing myself! But I found the information you seek. Here
column4: I wrote a letter with some very interesting bits on our friend
column5: Nazz Steamboil. Do with it what you will -- it's too dangerous for me to use. Just don't tell anyone where you got it!

column1: Back to Booty Bay^43^All^Thousand Needles^Kravel Koalbeard^Crank Fizzlebub^^Rumors for Kravel^Zanzil's Mixture and a Fool's Stout^Bring Kravel's Scheme to Crank Fizzlebub at Booty Bay in Stranglethorn Vale.^<name>
column2: you're a <class> I can trust
column3: both to get the job done and to keep your mouth shut while doing it. I've been brewing up a new scheme. It's risky
column4: but if it works then we could both make a bundle! And I think you're just the person to see it through. To start
column5: you must go back to Booty Bay. I apologize
column6: good <name>. I know my last task took you there. But this time
column7: speak with Crank Fizzlebub. Give him this letter. And if he requires aid
column8: do your best to help him. It will be worth the effort.

column1: Zanzil's Mixture and a Fool's Stout^44^All^Thousand Needles^Crank Fizzlebub^Kravel Koalbeard^^Zanzil's Secret
column2: Back to Booty Bay^Get the Gnomes Drunk
column3: Get the Goblins Drunk^Bring the Fool's Stout back to Kravel on the Shimmering Flats in Thousand Needles.^I figured out how to use Zanzil's mixture with stout to make a powerful libation. A Fool's Stout. I think it'll be just what Kravel needs
column4: but try it out and let me know how it works. And <name>
column5: don't keep this stuff too long without using it. Zanzil's mixture has a weird effect on the stout's yeast
column6: kicking it into high gear. So it won't stay fresh forever.

column1: Get the Gnomes Drunk^44^All^Thousand Needles^Kravel Koalbeard^Gnome Pit Boss^^Zanzil's Mixture and a Fool's Stout^Report Back to Fizzlebub^Bring the Fool's Stout to the Gnome Pit Boss at Mirage Raceway in Thousand Needles.^We need to try the Fool's Stout on one of the pit crews. If you want to try it on the gnomes
column2: then here -- take the stout and give it to the gnome pit boss. And don't wait too long. This stout will go bad eventually.

column1: Get the Goblins Drunk^44^All^Thousand Needles^Kravel Koalbeard^Goblin Pit Boss^^Zanzil's Mixture and a Fool's Stout^Report Back to Fizzlebub^Bring the Fool's Stout to the Goblin Pit Boss at Mirage Raceway in Thousand Needles.^We need to try the Fool's Stout on one of the pit crews. If you want to try it on the goblins
column2: then here -- take the stout and give it to the goblin pit boss. And don't wait too long. This stout will go bad eventually.

column1: Report Back to Fizzlebub^44^All^Thousand Needles^Kravel Koalbeard^Crank Fizzlebub^^^^Bring the Fool's Stout report to Crank Fizzlebub at Booty Bay in Stranglethorn Vale.^That Fool's Stout worked great! I placed a bet on the next race
column2: and... let's hope the crew you got drunk did a number on their car! There's only one more task for you -- take this note back to Crank Fizzlebub in Booty Bay. He'll want to know of the successful test. And hopefully we can get more of that Fool's Stout for future races!

column1: Rabine Saturna^55^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem^Rabine Saturna^The New Frontier^^Wasteland^Speak with Rabine Saturna in the village of Nighthaven
column2: Moonglade. Moonglade lies between Felwood and Winterspring
column3: accessible through a path out of Timbermaw Hold.^For this task
column4: Keeper Remulos' majordomo in Moonglade - Rabine Saturna - seeks aid in exploring the vast wastelands far to the west of Tanaris and Un'Goro. He is located in Nighthaven
column5: the main village of Moonglade. I want to impart on you the importance of your presence. There are growing tensions between the night elves of Darnassus and the Cenarion Circle in Moonglade. Look beyond racial boundaries and tap into the wisdom of your ancestors in dealings with the Circle there
column6: <name>. Good luck.

column1: Wasteland^55^All^Moonglade^Rabine Saturna^Layo Starstrike^The New Frontier^^^Speak with Layo Starstrike near the Valor's Rest graveyard of Silithus
column2: showing him Rabine's Letter.^West of Un'Goro Crater
column3: via the northwestern ridge
column4: is a harsh wasteland - Silithus. Few know that an ancient war was waged there between the night elves and a malign
column5: alien power. The evil was sealed
column6: but now we suspect that forces work to stir this... unspeakable horror. Seek out Layo Starstrike
column7: one of our agents in Silithus; look for him at Valor's Rest
column8: the final resting spot for the fallen of the wastes. Give him this letter
column9: and he will give you his trust accordingly.

column1: The Spirits of Southwind^55^All^Silithus^Layo Starstrike^Layo Starstrike^The New Frontier^^^Free the spirits of 8 Tortured Druids and 8 Tortured Sentinels in Southwind Village
column2: and then return to Layo Starstrike at the Valor's Rest graveyard of Silithus.^To our southwest lies a tragic site - the ruins of Southwind Village. This is where our work should begin
column3: <name>. From what we've learned
column4: this village was once a night elf base of operations for Silithus. It's long since overrun by the silithid hives that infest the wastes. I can only imagine the horror of the village's initial sundering... The tortured spirits of fallen druids and sentinels wander the ruins aimlessly. Explore this locale
column5: freeing the souls of these wretched beings as needed.

column1: Hive in the Tower^57^All^Silithus^Layo Starstrike^Layo Starstrike^The New Frontier^^^Scale the tower of Southwind Village and locate a means to stir the silithid hive into activity. Bring back anything unusual you may uncover when doing so to Layo Starstrike at the Valor's Rest graveyard of Silithus.^The hive needs to be addressed in Southwind Village
column2: and I think I know a way to get at them. It's been my experience that the silithid hives are very sensitive to their environment; this explains their attacks when hearing the death wails of the spirits. The silithid are strongest in the tower - the one with the mass of wasps circling it. Scale the tower and jostle the hive into activity. Report back what you learn
column3: but be careful! If you uncover anything that might help
column4: bring it to me.

column1: Fool's Stout^44^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Crank Fizzlebub^Crank Fizzlebub^^^^Bring 12 of Zanzil's Mixture to Crank Fizzlebub in Booty Bay.^So you want some Fool's Stout
column2: eh? Thinking of heading back to the races...? All right
column3: bring me more of Zanzil's mixture and I'll make some more stout for you.

column1: Melor Sends Word^30^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Jorn Skyseer^Melor Stonehoof^Melor Sends Word^^^Speak with Melor Stonehoof in Thunder Bluff.^<name>
column2: Melor Stonehoof has heard of your deeds
column3: and has set a path before you. If you wish to take it
column4: then go to Thunder Bluff and speak with Melor. You will find him on Hunter's Rise.

column1: Steelsnap^30^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Melor Stonehoof^Melor Stonehoof^Melor Sends Word^^Frostmaw^Bring Steelsnap's Rib to Melor Stonehoof in Thunder Bluff.^At times we hunt for food. At times we hunt for honor. And at times we hunt to earn the Earthmother's teachings. But the hunt I now set upon you is none of these things. It is to slay a creature outside the Earthmother's blessing. The hyena Steelsnap roams the Thousand Needles
column2: south of the Barrens. He is a tyrant
column3: attracting other hyenas to him and spreading fear and bloodshed among more peaceful beasts. Find Steelsnap
column4: <name>. Find him
column5: and defeat him.

column1: Pridewings of Stonetalon^21^Alliance^Ashenvale^Shindrell Swiftfire^Shindrell Swiftfire^^The Zoram Strand^^Bring 12 Pridewing Venom Sacs to Shindrell Swiftfire in Astranaar.^We are not in open war with the Horde
column2: but our peace is fragile. We often find their agents moving against us
column3: but they do so covertly. One such advance was revealed to us from hidden sources in Theramore
column4: claiming that the orcs collect venom from the pridewings near Mirkfallon Lake
column5: in the Stonetalon Mountains to the south. Orc assassins then use the venom on their secret death raids against the Alliance! If this is true
column6: then we must stop them
column7: <name>. We must deny them their source of venom.

column1: Frostmaw^37^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Melor Stonehoof^Melor Stonehoof^^Steelsnap^^Bring Frostmaw's Mane to Melor Stonehoof in Thunder Bluff.^<name>
column2: it is now time for you to travel to far-off lands. You are ready. You now hunt Frostmaw
column3: a yeti in the Alterac Mountains. He is elusive
column4: his white coat blending into the snows of his mountain home. He rarely shows himself. But I will show you how to entice a creature such as he. Here
column5: take this scroll. On it I have written how Frostmaw may be lured. Now go
column6: <name>. Your journey is long and many challenges lay waiting. When you return with Frostmaw's mane
column7: only then is your task complete.

column1: News for Fizzle^38^All^Thousand Needles^Martek the Exiled^Fizzle Brassbolts^^Indurium^Keeping Pace^Speak with Fizzle Brassbolts on the Shimmering Flats in Thousand Needles.^Indurium has an amazing resistance to heat! I'm sure it will work for Fizzle's pistons. But he'll need true indurium ore
column2: not just the flakes. To get the ore
column3: it must be mined from deep within Uldaman
column4: on the northern borders of the Badlands. That is the true source of indurium. Send Fizzle Brassbolts my regards
column5: and tell him what I told you. Safe travels
column6: <name>. And it won't surprise me if we meet again -- once Fizzle learns of indurium he'll probably send you to Uldaman to acquire it!

column1: Fruit of the Sea^17^All^Darkshore^Gubber Blump^Gubber Blump^^^^Collect 6 Fine Crab Chunks for Gubber Blump in Auberdine.^I love crab. Crabs are the fruit of the sea! You can bake it
column2: barbecue it
column3: boil it
column4: and broil it. They're pan fried
column5: deep fried
column6: and stir fried. There's crab salad
column7: crab soup
column8: crab stew
column9: pepper crab
column10: lemon crab
column11: whipper root crab
column12: and Ironforge surprise crab. That's... that's about it. I'm here fishing right now
column13: so I can't get any fine crab chunks. You can pick them out of reef crawlers and encrusted tide crawlers. You can make a lot with it. You can bake it

column1: The Lost Tablets of Will^45^Alliance^Ironforge^Advisor Belgrum^Advisor Belgrum^^An Ambassador of Evil^^Find the Tablet of Will
column2: and return them to Advisor Belgrum in Ironforge.^We've slowed the Shadowforge clan by cutting them off from Blackrock Spire
column3: but Hammertoe's quest is still unfulfilled. His death must not be in vain. He dreamt of finding the Tablet of Will: a stone shard inscribed with magic by the titans themselves to help imbue their creations with life--making them have a will of their own
column4: or so the legends say. We must still recover the Tablet before the Shadowforge clan finds it. Return to Uldaman
column5: find the tablet
column6: and return here immediately.

column1: The Tower of Althalaxx^28^All^Darkshore^Delgren the Purifier^Delgren the Purifier^The Tower of Althalaxx^^^Free the trapped Highborne souls in Night Run and Satyrnaar
column2: then return to Delgren the Purifier at Maestra's Post.^The writing of the orcs is little better than the scribblings of a child. Many of my order scoffed when I chose to learn their tongue
column3: but I have found it beneficial to gain further understanding of my enemies. From Ilkrud's scribblings
column4: it appears that Athrikus still possesses two soulgems
column5: and they are being held in Night Run and Satyrnaar
column6: satyr-held areas in northeast Ashenvale. Be careful out there
column7: <name>
column8: the satyrs' blood-soaked temples can be unsettling even for a seasoned <class> such as yourself.

column1: The Family and the Fishing Pole^14^All^Darkshore^Gubber Blump^Gubber Blump^^^^Catch 6 Darkshore Grouper for Gubber Blump in Auberdine.^I love fishing. The Blump family is known for fishing. My name is Gubber Blump; I fish. There's a kind of fish I like to catch around these parts called Darkshore grouper. I used to go out on a boat to fish for grouper
column2: but no boats have been going out since them mean ol' murlocs moved in. I bet they been eating up all the grouper too. Say
column3: you wanna help me catch Darkshore grouper? I'd give you a bona fide Blump Family Fishing Pole if you did! It's a real good pole to catch fish with.

column1: Mortality Wanes^30^All^Darnassus^Heralath Fallowbrook^Treshala Fallowbrook^^^^Find and return Treshala's Pendant to Treshala Fallowbrook in Darnassus.^I have not long to live... so... so... weak. ...the b-b-brave dwarf
column2: Lonebrow
column3: has been sent to w-w-warn Falfindel... But before I... d-d-die... ...my wife
column4: Treshala... her pendant of bonding to me... stolen... by one of the f-f-foul aggressors... Find it p-p-please... and return it to Treshala in Darnassus... ...along with w-w-word of my lonely... death.

column1: The Tower of Althalaxx^31^All^Darkshore^Balthule Shadowstrike^Balthule Shadowstrike^The Tower of Althalaxx^^^Kill Athrikus Narassin and bring his head to Balthule Shadowstrike near the Tower of Althalaxx.^I see. Well
column2: if what you say is true
column3: then now is the time to strike. I believe Athrikus resides at the top of the tower. Be careful though
column4: he is surrounded by many powerful warlocks
column5: much more deadly than the ones you faced before.

column1: Willix the Importer^30^All^Ratchet^Willix the Importer^Willix the Importer^^^^Escort Willix the Importer to the exit of Razorfen Kraul.^At last
column2: help has arrived! You have no clue how long I've been held prisoner here. I can't remember the last time I saw the outside of this place. You see
column3: I am an entrepreneur. Always out for a copper
column4: as they say. I caught wind that Mebok Mizzyrix was paying well for Blueleaf Tuber from this here pig pen. I figured it would be an easy in
column5: easy out kind of affair. As you can see
column6: I was a bit wrong! Anyway
column7: if you'd be so kind as to help me get out of here
column8: I'll make it worth your while.

column1: The Swarm Grows^33^Horde^The Barrens^Korran^Belgrom Rockmaul^The Swarm Grows^^^Deliver Korran's Sealed Note to Belgrom Rockmaul in Orgrimmar.^Many travelers who've come through the Crossroads helped me gather eggs from the Field of Giants
column2: and many of them have tales of how deadly the creatures are. I've heard enough to consider them insects a much larger threat than my masters first thought. I need a courier to travel to Orgrimmar to meet Belgrom Rockmaul. It be no simple matter
column3: and someone who would take the task seriously should go. Belgrom usually be found outside the warriors' guild house.

column1: The Swarm Grows^33^Horde^Orgrimmar^Belgrom Rockmaul^Moktar Krin^The Swarm Grows^^^Deliver Belgrom's Sealed Note to Moktar Krin in Thousand Needles.^So
column2: Korran has come to a similar conclusion about these insects--they seem to be a larger threat than we assumed. A few days ago a hunter returned to me from Thousand Needles nearly dead. He was with a raiding party sent to drive a dwarven excavation team out of the Shimmering Flats. During the attack
column3: more of these insects erupted from a cave in the dig site and nearly killed the party. They were led by Moktar Krin
column4: and they've taken refuge on the border of the Shimmering Flats. Bring him this note.

column1: The Swarm Grows^35^Horde^Thousand Needles^Moktar Krin^Moktar Krin^The Swarm Grows^^^Kill 5 Silithid Searchers
column2: 5 Silithid Hive Drones
column3: and 5 Silithid Invaders and return to Moktar Krin in Thousand Needles.^Hmm. Seems Belgrom thinks those monsters are a threat. He wants them pushed back into whatever depths they crawled up out of. I guess killing the dwarves sent by the Explorers' League wasn't enough--now I have to send a half-dead war party into another battle. We won't be able to do it ourselves; not while we're in this condition. The dig site's to the south of here. There shouldn't be anymore dwarves to deal with. Feel up to wielding a blade or staff and doing your part to aid us?

column1: Parts of the Swarm^35^Horde^Thousand Needles^Cracked Silithid Carapace^Korran^Parts of the Swarm^^^Bring 1 Silithid Heart
column2: 5 Silithid Talons
column3: and 3 Intact Silithid Carapaces
column4: to Korran at the Crossroads.^You inspect the carapace carefully. As you turn it over in your hands you realize that the chitinous plating is interlaced in such a way that makes it incredibly strong. It's unlike anything you've ever seen. You inspect the rest of the corpse further and realize that these creatures are very powerful and highly evolved. Looking down at the carapace again
column5: you think that Korran would enjoy studying more of these creatures. It could help him figure out what these creatures are
column6: and where they come from.

column1: Test of Faith^26^Horde^Thousand Needles^Dorn Plainstalker^Dorn Plainstalker^Test of Faith^^^If you have faith
column2: leap from the planks overlooking Thousand Needles.^So
column3: you have sought me out
column4: or perhaps destiny brings you to me? No matter. You are here now
column5: and so your journey will begin anew. Many facets make up a being: the spirit
column6: the body
column7: the mind. Some of these can be measured by a culture's traditions. Others we can only hope exist within ourselves. If you agree
column8: I shall test some of the facets within you. If you pass
column9: then you shall become stronger. If you fail
column10: then you will realize the vastness of the Nether. The first is a Test of Faith.

column1: Test of Endurance^30^Horde^Thousand Needles^Dorn Plainstalker^Dorn Plainstalker^Test of Faith^^^Bring Grenka's Claw to Dorn Plainstalker in Thousand Needles.^I'm pleased to see your courage remains steadfast in light of what you've already done. Since your faith is intact
column2: the time has come to test your body. First is a test of endurance. Go to the Roguefeather Den west of Freewind Post. Make your way to the depths of their lair and destroy their foodstuffs. By then you should have provoked their fury
column3: and if you are able to survive long enough
column4: Grenka Bloodscreech herself will come for you--kill her and bring me her claw to complete your test.

column1: Test of Strength^30^Horde^Thousand Needles^Dorn Plainstalker^Dorn Plainstalker^Test of Faith^^^Bring Fragments of Rok'Alim to Dorn Plainstalker in Thousand Needles.^During the time of the Old Gods
column2: elementals inhabited much of this world. They worshipped the Old Gods
column3: and the Gods
column4: through their power
column5: kept the elementals bound to this world. When the Old Gods were banished
column6: the elementals faded from our world and now only return at the bidding of powerful mages. There are exceptions though. Some elementals were powerful enough to remain here on their own. One such elemental is Rok'Alim. To test your strength
column7: find Rok'Alim in Thousand Needles and slay him.

column1: Test of Lore^30^Horde^Thousand Needles^Dorn Plainstalker^Braug Dimspirit^Test of Faith^^^Find Braug Dimspirit near the entrance to Talondeep Path in Stonetalon Mountains.^Your time with me is just about finished. I am knowledgeable
column2: but the Test of Lore is not mine to give. There are lessons to be learned and places to visit that others claim domain over. If you are prepared
column3: then seek out Braug Dimspirit--he is a shaman of great wisdom. He will test you further
column4: so heed his words
column5: <name>. When you are ready
