column6: find the tunnel that connects the Stonetalon Mountains with Ashenvale: Braug dwells near there. And be careful
column7: <name>
column8: the night elves may wish to impede your test.

column1: A New Ore Sample^29^Horde^The Barrens^Tatternack Steelforge^Tatternack Steelforge^^Weapons of Choice^^Find an Unrefined Ore Sample on a Gravelsnout Digger or Surveyor and bring it to Tatternack Steelforge at Camp Taurajo in the Barrens.^<class>
column2: you have done well in helping me in the past. The warchief is pleased thus far with what I've accomplished
column3: and asks me to continue with renewed determination. My honor dictates that I give you proper recognition to the warchief for all you have done
column4: but first I would ask you for your help again. Travelers recently came from the south from a place called Thousand Needles. There they killed a kobold who had an unusual ore sample
column5: but they would not sell it. I want a sample of that ore to examine.

column1: Test of Lore^30^Horde^Thousand Needles^Braug Dimspirit^Braug Dimspirit^Test of Faith^^^Find the Legacy of the Aspects and return it to Braug Dimspirit near the entrance to Talondeep Path in Stonetalon Mountains.^You have passed Dorn's tests
column2: and now you seek to pass your next trial. Very good. But up until now
column3: your challenges have been childish. It is easy to test your body--your mind is another matter completely. I shall explain it simply: find the book I name
column4: study it
column5: and answer my question about its contents. What book
column6: you must be asking? The Legacy of the Aspects. It can be found at the bottom of Dor'danil in southern Ashenvale
column7: protected by the dead druids and their slayers.

column1: Test of Lore^30^Horde^Thousand Needles^Braug Dimspirit^Parqual Fintallas^Test of Faith^^^Find Parqual Fintallas in Undercity.^Well done
column2: <name>. You have passed the first portion of the Test of Lore
column3: but there is still another question to be answered. But that question is not mine to ask. Seek out Parqual Fintallas in Lordaeron City. He was a great historian for the humans before the Plague overtook him. Now he continues to seek enlightenment
column4: but of a different nature. He will have another requirement of you before he asks you anything
column5: but you have done masterfully thus far--I'm sure you will overcome his obstacle.

column1: Test of Lore^36^Horde^Scarlet Monastery^Parqual Fintallas^Parqual Fintallas^Test of Faith^^^Find The Beginnings of the Undead Threat
column2: and return it to Parqual Fintallas in Undercity.^I will tell you what you must seek
column3: and I will even ask you my question
column4: but not because you wish to prove yourself. Knowledge is far more important than strength. Even as others seem to pass you by in ability
column5: your knowledge of the world will be more valuable. Go to the Monastery in the north of Tirisfal Glades. In the library there
column6: a book called Beginnings of the Undead Threat resides. It was used by the now-corrupt paladins there to train them to fight my kind. Bring it to me.

column1: To Steal From Thieves^36^Horde^Undercity^Genavie Callow^Genavie Callow^^^^Bring Kenata
column2: Fardel
column3: and Marcel Dabyrie's Heads to Genavie Callow in Undercity.^The harlot! The swine! Kenata still lives; her family healthy and prospering while I suffer. Forsaken indeed! My family is gone
column4: taken by the plague. Our estate also forfeit; looted and burned during the war. And after all that
column5: her and her lousy children had the audacity to steal the only precious belongings I had left. I don't care about the things they stole any more. What I want now are their heads! Kill them for me! Go to the Dabyrie Farmstead in Arathi
column6: northeast of Refuge Point.

column1: Overlord Mok'Morokk's Concern^41^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Overlord Mok'Morokk^Overlord Mok'Morokk^^^^Overlord Mok'Morokk in Brackenwall Village wants you to retrieve his grog
column2: snuff and strongbox in Dustwallow Swamp.^Bow before Overlord Mok'Morokk! Rexxar make me mighty leader of Stonemaul Clan! Me good leader. Me keep clan safe. Big dragons come and make fire at old home. Me smart ogre. Find new home for clan here. Leave old home so fast
column3: me forget stuff. Tiny <race>
column4: go get my things. Go south and find my yummy grog
column5: my snuff and my strongbox. Me like you after you do that. You look in Den of Flame and Stonemaul Ruins... they be there
column6: me sure!

column1: The Tower of Althalaxx^28^All^Darkshore^Delgren the Purifier^Balthule Shadowstrike^The Tower of Althalaxx^^^Speak with Balthule Shadowstrike near the Tower of Althalaxx.^Before confronting Athrikus
column2: it would probably be wise for you to consult with Balthule. I have no doubt he has been vigilant in his watch of the Tower
column3: and he may have information about recent developments.

column1: Army of the Black Dragon^41^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Tharg^Tharg^^^^Tharg in Brackenwall Village wants you to kill 10 Firemane Scouts
column2: 10 Firemane Ash Tails
column3: and 5 Firemane Scalebanes.^Mok'Morokk was made Overlord by Rexxar. He care more for power than he care for ogres. Black dragons kill many ogre. Kill Tharg's wife. Mok'Morokk tell us to run. Make us come here. Ogre should fight. Ogres not good at running. Mok'Morokk care only about Mok'Morokk. Me call Stonemaul Ruins home. Me like it in the south. This place not home. Help ogres fight army of the black dragon. Me want revenge. Me want to go home.

column1: Identifying the Brood^41^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Draz'Zilb^Draz'Zilb^^^The Brood of Onyxia^Draz'Zilb in Brackenwall Village would like you to bring him 7 Searing Tongues and 7 Searing Hearts.^Whilst that craven fool
column2: Mok'Morokk
column3: wallows in power and Tharg wrestles the demons of sorrow and vengeance and vies for leadership of the clan
column4: I seem to be the only one concerned with identifying the source of aggression on our old home. Why the puzzled stare
column5: <name>? Expecting me to speak like an uncouth ruffian merely because I am an ogre? Now back to business
column6: bring to me the hearts and tongues from the whelps and hatchlings. I shall trace the root of this evil...

column1: The Brood of Onyxia^41^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Draz'Zilb^Overlord Mok'Morokk^The Brood of Onyxia^Identifying the Brood^^Speak with Overlord Mok'Morokk in Brackenwall Village.^Stonemaul Village was invaded by the brood of Onyxia. But why would the daughter of the black dragonlord
column2: Deathwing
column3: descend upon our lands? This is most troubling. Surely
column4: Onyxia was driven here for a purpose beyond laying siege to a small band of ogres. Notify Mok'Morokk at once! Action must be taken.

column1: The Brood of Onyxia^41^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Overlord Mok'Morokk^Draz'Zilb^The Brood of Onyxia^^^Speak with Draz'Zilb in Brackenwall Village.^You leave me alone now. Go tell Draz'Zilb we stay here. No black dragon here.

The Brood of Onyxia^41^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Draz'Zilb^Draz'Zilb^The Brood of Onyxia^^Challenge Overlord Mok'Morokk^Draz'Zilb in Brackenwall Village wants you to destroy 5 Eggs of Onyxia.^Onyxia's brood has been scattered across the Dragonmurk. It is imperative that no more whelps be permitted to hatch. Make haste to Wyrmbog in the south of Dustwallow Marsh. Surely
column2: she has made her lair there. Track down the evil dragon's eggs and destroy them. We will never reclaim Stonemaul Village if the surrounding area remains a breeding ground. As for Mok'Morokk... I have other plans for the sod.

column1: Challenge Overlord Mok'Morokk^45^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Overlord Mok'Morokk^Draz'Zilb^^The Brood of Onyxia^^Defeat Mok'Morokk and report the news to Draz'Zilb in Brackenwall Village.^You dare challenge Overlord Mok'Morokk? Haw! Me crush tiny <race>! You tell me when ready for good beating.
A Bump in the Road^33^All^Thousand Needles^Trackmaster Zherin^Trackmaster Zherin^^^^Kill 10 Saltstone Basilisks
column2: 10 Saltstone Crystalhides and 6 Saltstone Gazers for Trackmaster Zherin on the Shimmering Flats.^After the big crash with the goblins' Red Thunder racer and a basilisk
column3: Kronkrider hired me on to take care of the track. I don't know what all the animals out on the flats are feeding on to grow so big
column4: but we have to be careful to thin them out so they won't wander onto the track when a race is going on. Tell you what. If you want to go out and make a little profit
column5: go out and remove the basilisks from the area.

column1: Load Lightening^30^All^Thousand Needles^Pozzik^Pozzik^Load Lightening^^^Get 10 Hollow Vulture Bones for Pozzik in the Shimmering Flats.^When it comes to racing
column2: every bit counts! Whether it's a minor tweaking on the power output
column3: a slight slackening on the tension coils
column4: or lightening the weight of the frame
column5: you have to take everything into account. We use vulture bones for a lot of the minor structural tweaks we make to our racers
column6: which offer the perfect balance of strength and weight. Even better
column7: it's easy for us to get more
column8: as the salt flats are littered with vultures. Bring me some and I'll give you a good price on them.

column1: Hungry!^36^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Mudcrush Durtfeet^Mudcrush Durtfeet^^^^Mudcrush Durtfeet in northern Dustwallow wants 8 Mirefin Heads.^Mud big ogre. Me hungry. Go bash fishy. Bring Mud food. You feed Mud or Mud eat you.

Goblin Sponsorship^37^All^Thousand Needles^Pozzik^Gazlowe^Load Lightening^^^Speak to Gazlowe at Ratchet in The Barrens.^Our racing team is the pride of goblins everywhere. You'd be surprised at some of the people who contribute in one way or another to our team. You know Gazlowe? He tracks down parts from around the world for us. He even came down to work on one of our rigs once! A few weeks ago
column2: he said he'd send us a new prototype fuel regulator but it hasn't come yet. He's usually very prompt... Maybe you wouldn't mind going to Ratchet to ask him about it? I wouldn't be so pushy
column3: but the gnomes are gaining on us!

column1: The Brassbolts Brothers^30^Alliance^Thousand Needles^Pilot Longbeard^Wizzle Brassbolts^^^^Bring the crate of crash helmets to Wizzle Brassbolts at Mirage Raceway in Thousand Needles.^You ever heard of the Shimmering Flats? It's a stretch of salt flats way over in Kalimdor
column2: just south of the Thousand Needles canyon. It's a great place for racing because
column3: well
column4: it's so flat! A couple of gnome brothers are out there
column5: friends of mine
column6: trying out their new rocket car
column7: and from what I hear it's fast! Heh
column8: so fast that their pilots keep crashing. Giving themselves concussions. So they asked me for some Siege Engine helmets
column9: but I have duties here. I can't make the trip! Can you?

column1: Goblin Sponsorship^37^All^Thousand Needles^Gazlowe^Wharfmaster Lozgil^Load Lightening^^^Speak with Wharfmaster Lozgil at Booty Bay in Stranglethorn Vale.^Back to what you came here about. I know I promised Pozzik that I'd deliver a new fuel regulator for him
column2: but I still haven't received it yet. Revilgaz over in Booty Bay said he'd have it shipped over
column3: but it might be it slipped through the cracks somehow. If that's true
column4: there's not much we can do about it. We can at least find out if it was dispatched from Booty Bay. Check in with Wharfmaster Lozgil over there
column5: he should be able to check the cargo records.

column1: Goblin Sponsorship^37^All^Thousand Needles^Wharfmaster Lozgil^Baron Revilgaz^Load Lightening^^^Speak with Baron Revilgaz in Booty Bay.^I'm afraid I can't be of much more help to you
column2: <name>. If you'd like to follow up on it more
column3: I'd suggest you go hit up the Baron himself. If there's anyone who knows Revilgaz's business
column4: it's Revilgaz. You'll find him at the tavern across the harbor
column5: top floor.

column1: Goblin Sponsorship^37^All^Thousand Needles^Baron Revilgaz^Baron Revilgaz^Load Lightening^^^Bring the Fuel Regulator Blueprints to Baron Revilgaz in Booty Bay.^See
column2: the Venture Company shredders out in Lake Nazferiti (in northern Stranglethorn) have been equipped with a new model fuel regulator. I was thinking that Pozzik would be able to take advantage of it
column3: if he could get some details. Unfortunately
column4: Cozzle
column5: the foreman out there
column6: appears to be a little more clever than I gave him credit for. You seem like you might have more luck finding the blueprints though. I know he keeps them in his house
column7: but they're almost certainly under lock and key.

column1: Goblin Sponsorship^37^All^Thousand Needles^Baron Revilgaz^Pozzik^Load Lightening^^^Deliver the Fuel Regulator Blueprints to Pozzik on the Shimmering Flats.^You should be all set to go. Give Pozzik my regards and tell him that if he ever needs anything
column2: not to hesitate to ask. I'll be waiting for the news that he breaks the track record soon!

column1: Parts of the Swarm^35^Horde^Thousand Needles^Korran^Belgrom Rockmaul^Parts of the Swarm^^^Return to Belgrom Rockmaul in Orgrimmar.^Head back to Belgrom in Orgrimmar and tell him Moktar be doing his bidding well out in the Thousand Needles. Tell him also
column2: that me studies progress
column3: and I hope to be havin' learned more soon. That should please him greatly.

column1: The Eighteenth Pilot^37^All^Thousand Needles^Pozzik^Razzeric^Load Lightening^^^Speak with Razzeric on the Shimmering Flats in Thousand Needles.^I'm going to be busy with working on integrating this new fuel regulator to our racer designs
column2: but if you'd like to help out the team some more
column3: talk to Razzeric. He's our pilot--well
column4: our eighteenth pilot
column5: to be exact--and he likes to add his own little modifications to the racers. He's a little off his rocker
column6: though
column7: so try not to act too surprised.

column1: Razzeric's Tweaking^41^All^Thousand Needles^Razzeric^Razzeric^Load Lightening^^^Retrieve the Seaforium Booster for Razzeric in the Shimmering Flats.^Pozzik's a great mechanic
column2: I know that
column3: but he's afraid to just load on the firepower and grab on for the ride. Not me
column4: though. After Pozzik finishes with a racer
column5: I take a little time to put my own modifications on--you know
column6: loosening up the controls
column7: removing parts of the frame
column8: and adding more juice! I ordered a seaforium booster from Shreev at the Gizmorium in Gadgetzan
column9: but apparently the zeppelin it was being sent on crashed in Dustwallow Marsh! I gotta have it
column10: <name>!

column1: Safety First^41^All^Thousand Needles^Razzeric^Shreev^Load Lightening^^^Bring the Seaforium Booster to Shreev at Gadgetzan in Tanaris.^But wait
column2: what's this? Shreev left the safety on. That will limit the amount of power I can draw from the booster at any time. I told him I wanted it off! This is no good. You have to take this to the Gadgetzan Gizmorium in the Tanaris Desert and have Shreev remove this.

column1: Safety First^41^All^Thousand Needles^Shreev^Razzeric^Load Lightening^^^Return the Modified Seaforium Booster to Razzeric on the Shimmering Flats in Thousand Needles.^There
column2: I did what Razzeric wanted. Just tell him to be careful when he sets this off. If he makes the slightest mistake
column3: he won't be moving forward
column4: he'll just be a burnt spot on the track. Would be a shame
column5: too
column6: if that happened. Who knows if our nineteenth driver would be any good?

column1: Keeping Pace^41^All^Thousand Needles^Pozzik^Rizzle's Unguarded Plans^Keeping Pace^News for Fizzle^^Have Zamek create a diversion
column2: then steal Rizzle's plans for Pozzik on the Shimmering Flats in Thousand Needles.^The Brassbolts brothers have discovered a new building material
column3: that's the only explanation that makes sense. Their cars have been operating faster than before
column4: but their designs
column5: and all the other data we've gathered from their runs is identical. What we do know
column6: is that Rizzle Brassbolts has been focused on the plans for this new discovery almost constantly. Zamek can create a diversion for you
column7: so that you can steal those plans from them.

column1: Rizzle's Schematics^41^All^Thousand Needles^Rizzle's Unguarded Plans^Pozzik^Keeping Pace^^Indurium Ore^Bring the Sample of Indurium Ore to Pozzik on the Shimmering Flats in Thousand Needles.^Rizzle's schematics describe the process of the refinement of indurium ore. From his scrawls
column2: it is apparent that indurium ore is being obtained from the dwarven excavation site of Uldaman in the Badlands. Much of the other notes relate to the heat resistant properties. Used as a paperweight for the plans is a hunk of what appears to be unrefined indurium ore.

column1: The Sacred Flame^25^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Zangen Stonehoof^Zangen Stonehoof^The Sacred Flame^^^Return a Filled Etched Phial to Zangen Stonehoof in Thunder Bluff.^The Galak centaur in the Thousand Needles are protecting an artifact from the time of the centaurs' creation. We would like to retrieve it
column2: but we require a phial of water from one of the night elves' moonwells. To collect the water
column3: you will first need to obtain one of the phials carried by the dryads near the Raynewood Retreat in the heart of Ashenvale Forest. There is a moonwell near the western bank of the Falfarren River
column4: south of the main road
column5: where you can fill the phial.

column1: The Sacred Flame^29^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Zangen Stonehoof^Rau Cliffrunner^The Sacred Flame^^^Deliver the Filled Etched Phial to Rau Cliffrunner at the Freewind Post.^Bring the filled phial to Rau Cliffrunner at the Freewind Post in southeastern Thousand Needles. You can get to the Thousand Needles by taking the Great Lift at the southern edge of the Barrens. I wouldn't be surprised if you can help us out further.
The Sacred Flame^29^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Rau Cliffrunner^Rau Cliffrunner^The Sacred Flame^^^Retrieve the Cloven Hoof for Rau Cliffrunner at the Freewind Post.^Using the water you brought
column2: you will be able to temporarily douse the flame that holds the centaur relic. It will not work permanently
column3: however
column4: so you will have to be quick about it. You will find Splithoof Crag
column5: the centaurs' stronghold
column6: to the north of here. The flame is kept in Splithoof Hold
column7: a heavily guarded part of the crag. Be careful
column8: though
column9: the Galak centaur have great numbers here
column10: and will be rather reluctant to surrender something so dear to them.

column1: In Search of Thaelrid^24^Alliance^Blackfathom Deeps^Dawnwatcher Shaedlass^Argent Guard Thaelrid^In Search of Thaelrid^^^Seek out Argent Guard Thaelrid in Blackfathom Deeps.^Many rumors circulate these days about the union of the Twilight's Hammer and the naga in Blackfathom Deeps on the coasts of Ashenvale. My role here with the Argent Dawn is to collect as much information as I can
column2: so we know when and where help is needed. It has been weeks now since I sent a scout to check on the activity at Blackfathom Deeps. Argent Guard Thaelrid has not yet reported back. My other scouts are preoccupied with pressing matters. Seek out and aid Thaelrid for me
column3: <name>.

column1: Twilight Falls^25^Alliance^Blackfathom Deeps^Argent Guard Manados^Argent Guard Manados^^^^Bring 10 Twilight Pendants to Argent Guard Manados in Darnassus.^Empowered by the ancient rites of the chaotic Old Gods the members of the Twilight's Hammer strive to bring about the return of their dark patrons and spread death and terror across the world. We believe that the Twilight's Hammer has allied with the naga and are amassing in Blackfathom Deeps on the coast of Ashenvale. Whatever evil plan brews in the depths of the old temple must be thwarted. Wage war on the Hammer and bring back proof of your deeds. Your efforts will be rewarded handsomely.

Blackfathom Villainy^27^Alliance^Blackfathom Deeps^Argent Guard Thaelrid^Dawnwatcher Selgorm^In Search of Thaelrid^^^Bring the head of Twilight Lord Kelris to Dawnwatcher Selgorm in Darnassus.^Strength has left me. Your help is needed! Long ago this site was a great temple of Elune. But misfortune led to ruin when the corruption of an Old God seeped up from beneath the earth and tainted the sacred Moon Well. Aku'Mai
column2: servant of the Old God
column3: rose from the waters. The Twilight's Hammer cultists have allied with the naga to occupy these grounds. The cultists
column4: led by Kelris
column5: sacrifice innocents to Aku'Mai for power. Slay Kelris and bring his head to Selgorm in Darnassus
column6: <name>
column7: please.

column1: Theramore Spies^35^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Nazeer Bloodpike^Nazeer Bloodpike^Theramore Spies^^^Kill 9 Theramore Infiltrators
column2: then return to Nazeer Bloodpike in Brackenwall Village.^The Horde and Alliance hold an uneasy truce. Outlying skirmishes and covert actions are taken by one side against the other
column3: and it is our duty to ensure the Horde is on top! Now is the chance to do just that. Alliance infiltrators have taken positions east of Brackenwall Village. They spy on the village and report our movements to Theramore
column4: which we cannot allow. Hunt down the infiltrators and slay them. Send a clear message to their superiors that we will not tolerate their spies' presence!

column1: The Theramore Docks^35^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Nazeer Bloodpike^Nazeer Bloodpike^Theramore Spies^^^Bring the Captain's Documents to Nazeer Bloodpike in Brackenwall Village.^<name>
column2: two of our spies were sent to steal documents from a ship at the Theramore docks. They gained the papers but were discovered
column3: and were forced to throw the documents into the sea. One spy later escaped
column4: but was unable to recover the prize. He reported his failure to me
column5: and I now charge the task to you. The documents are in a footlocker
column6: in the waters somewhere beneath the Theramore docks. Find those documents
column7: <name>
column8: and bring them to me.

column1: Jarl Needs a Blade^35^All^Dustwallow Marsh^"Swamp Eye" Jarl^"Swamp Eye" Jarl^The Hermit of Witch Hill^^^Bring Razorspine's Sword to "Swamp Eye" Jarl at Swamplight Manor.^I have cutting to do. I can't tell you what I'm going to cut
column2: but... I need myself a blade. A certain blade... Some people call it a sword. I call it a swing blade. You help me? Those fish-men
column3: you know
column4: murlocs or whatever they're called.... There's one they call Razorspine
column5: carries a big sword
column6: lives north of here near the beach. That's the sword I need! But don't sleep on this. What I'm cutting won't keep forever...

column1: Mudrock Soup and Bugs^38^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Morgan Stern^Morgan Stern^Morgan Stern^^^Bring 8 Forked Mudrock Tongues to Morgan Stern in Theramore.^I'm working on a dish I call "Mudrock Soup and Bugs." I still need the major ingredients
column2: and... well
column3: I don't think I'd last long trudging through Dustwallow Marsh! So
column4: <name>
column5: can you do some hunting for me? First
column6: I need the tongues of Mudrock turtles. You can find Mudrocks along the coast
column7: mostly around the bay. But I don't want just any tongues! I hear that the tongues of some Mudrocks are forked... They say the forked tongues have a distinct flavor
column8: and I want that flavor in my dish...

column1: Deadmire^41^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Melor Stonehoof^Melor Stonehoof^^^^Bring Deadmire's Tooth to Melor in Thunder Bluff.^Deadmire is an ancient crocolisk in Dustwallow marsh. And it is his time to die. Old bones grind as he pulls his huge body through the swamp
column2: and although he still moves with the strength and speed of youth
column3: his aging body tortures the great spirit within it
column4: a spirit whose flame will not waver. Yet now he lives in constant
column5: maddening pain. You must end the life of this noble creature
column6: <name>. You must lead Deadmire to peace.

column1: Jarl Needs Eyes^35^All^Dustwallow Marsh^"Swamp Eye" Jarl^"Swamp Eye" Jarl^The Hermit of Witch Hill^^^Bring 20 Unpopped Darkmist Eyes to "Swamp Eye" Jarl at the Swamplight Manor.^Eye juice is good juice for drinking. Too bad most critters only have two eyes. But spiders have lots of eyes. Lots and lots. And Darkmist eye juice is tasty. Smooth and salty! Unpopped spider eyes... I taste them already. Darkmist spiders are west of here
column2: in the Darkmist Cavern. You figure the spiders are named after the cave... or is it the other way around?

column1: Marsh Frog Legs^35^All^Dustwallow Marsh^"Swamp Eye" Jarl^"Swamp Eye" Jarl^The Hermit of Witch Hill^^^Bring 10 Marsh Frog Legs to "Swamp Eye" Jarl in Dustwallow Marsh.^I like cooking. Good swamp cooking. Fried green frog legs and the like. And I'm all out of legs. The manor is overrun with frogs
column2: though. Giant marsh frogs. Think you could bring me some of those legs? Nothin' to it
column3: really. Just bop 'em on the head and bring me the legs. Then I'll make a stew and stew it up and suck it down and give you some too. Do you like stew?

column1: The Orc Report^35^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Loose Dirt^Lieutenant Aden^The Orc Report^^^Bring the Spy's Report to Lieutenant Aden in Theramore.^Sifting through the loose dirt
column2: the severed hand of an orc is found. And clutched in the hand is a bone-carved tube. And in the tube is a dirt-stained parchment. The parchment is written in orcish... and it looks important.

column1: Captain Vimes^35^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Theramore Lieutenant^Captain Garran Vimes^The Orc Report^^^Bring the Spy's Report to Captain Garran Vimes.^Captain Vimes should see the orc report you found
column2: <name>. He knows the orcish language better than most. And he should know that there are Horde spies near Theramore! The captain is in the barracks
column3: on the northeastern side of Theramore Isle.

column1: Blueleaf Tubers^26^All^The Barrens^Mebok Mizzyrix^Mebok Mizzyrix^^^^Grab a Crate with Holes.^Blueleaf tubers are a delicacy around the world! But they're rare
column2: very rare. The only place to find them is here in the Barrens
column3: deep in the earth
column4: in Razorfen Kraul. And even then
column5: they're impossible to find unless you know just where to look! That's why I've trained these snufflenose gophers to find them for me. They have great noses and can smell a tuber from fifty paces away. It won't be easy
column6: but if you get me some tubers I'll pay you handsomely.

column1: Stinky's Escape^37^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^"Stinky" Ignatz^Morgan Stern^^^Feast at the Blue Recluse^Escort "Stinky" Ignatz
column2: then speak with Morgan Stern in Theramore.^Great
column3: finally something that doesn't want to eat me! I need help handling the critters around here
column4: and you fit the mold
column5: <buddy/lady>. The cook Morgan Stern is researching a new recipe
column6: and he sent me out here to gather bogbean leaves. I guess he thinks they're tasty. Anyway
column7: while looking for a bogbean plant... I got myself surrounded! Can you help me out of here
column8: and watch my back as I look for the bogbean?

column1: The Lost Report^35^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Loose Dirt^Nazeer Bloodpike^^^The Severed Head^Bring the Spy's Report to Nazeer Bloodpike in Brackenwall Village.^Sifting through the loose dirt
column2: the severed hand of an orc is found. And clutched in the hand is a bone-carved tube. And in the tube is a dirt-stained parchment. The parchment is a report made by an orc who spent weeks spying on the city of Theramore. After scanning the parchment
column3: it is clear that it must be brought to the orc spymaster in Brackenwall Village.

column1: The Severed Head^35^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Loose Dirt^Nazeer Bloodpike^The Severed Head^The Lost Report^^Bring the Defiant Orc Head to Nazeer Bloodpike in Brackenwall Village.^Vigorous digging reveals the head of a male orc
column2: raggedly severed at the neck. His lips are frozen in a snarl
column3: and its dark eyes stare defiantly.

column1: The Troll Witchdoctor^35^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Nazeer Bloodpike^Kin'weelay^The Severed Head^^Marg Speaks^Take the Defiant Orc Head to Kin'weelay in the Grom'gol Base Camp in Stranglethorn Vale.^We must know the events surrounding Marg's death! And the only way to do that
column2: <name>
column3: is through the witch-magic of trolls. Bring Marg's head to Kin'weelay in Stranglethorn Vale
column4: at the Grom'gol Base Camp. Kin'weelay is the most powerful witchdoctor of the Darkspear trolls. If anyone can speak to Marg Nighteye's spirit
column5: it is he.

column1: The Missing Diplomat^28^Alliance^Stormwind City^Bishop DeLavey^Jorgen^The Missing Diplomat^^^Find Jorgen in Stormwind City.^Recently a diplomat was sent to Theramore to meet with Jaina Proudmoore. That diplomat never arrived. I believe the Defias are involved in this plot
column2: but I'm not sure how. The diplomat's disappearance still eludes public attention
column3: but it can't remain that way for long. Agents of the king are already scouring the city for clues
column4: but I have my own contacts I would like involved. In the Valley of Heroes is an old friend of mine named Jorgen. Find him
column5: give him this note
column6: and follow his instructions.

column1: The Missing Diplomat^28^All^Stormwind City^Jorgen^Elling Trias^The Missing Diplomat^^^Delivery Jorgen's Sealed Note to Elling Trias in Stormwind City.^Take this here note to Elling Trias. Don't say nothin' else to him. Just be polite and wait for him to respond. And don't worry
column2: he will. I'm gonna only impress this on ya once more
column3: <name>: treat this matter seriously
column4: and keep your yapper shut. Ya can find Trias at his cheese shop
column5: Trias' Cheese
column6: in the Trade District. Good luck.

column1: The Missing Diplomat^28^Alliance^Stormwind City^Elling Trias^Watcher Backus^The Missing Diplomat^^^Give the Sealed Note to Watcher Backus in Duskwood.^Jorgen
column2: you ol' sonuva.... So
column3: that's how it's going to be
column4: huh? All right
column5: I can deal with that. I hope he finds the Twisting Nether that much sooner! Here's what's gonna happen
column6: <name>. I'll start using my contacts here
column7: but you're doing most of the footwork so I save some coin. Head to Darkshire in Duskwood and find Watcher Backus--he usually patrols the north road right outside of town. Just tell him you're looking into any Defias activity for me and he'll help you out with any information he can.

column1: The Missing Diplomat^30^Alliance^Stormwind City^Watcher Backus^Watcher Backus^The Missing Diplomat^^^Find the Defias Docket and return it to Watcher Backus in Duskwood.^Defias activity? Well
column2: there's always some activity; even if they keep to themselves we consider them a threat. But now that I think about it
column3: there was a recent sighting that seemed odd. It must have been a couple weeks ago
column4: but some of their agents had gathered around Addle's Stead. From the report
column5: I'd guessed something big went down. Why don't you check there first and bring me back anything you find? The farmstead is south of the road from Westfall just as you enter Duskwood.

column1: The Missing Diplomat^30^Alliance^Stormwind City^Watcher Backus^Elling Trias^The Missing Diplomat^^^Bring the Defias Docket to Elling Trias in Stormwind.^Whoa
column2: this looks way too complex to be something to just lead you astray. I shouldn't even be looking at this stuff. Take it to Trias--he'll be able to make sense of it. And DON'T let anyone get in your way. This is bigger than me. It might even be bigger than him
column3: but we'll see. And do me a favor
column4: <name>
column5: don't tell anyone I helped you. If my superiors found out I knew about any of this and didn't share it with them they'd probably hang me.

column1: The Missing Diplomat^31^Alliance^Stormwind City^Elling Trias^Dashel Stonefist^The Missing Diplomat^^^Speak to Dashel Stonefist in Stormwind.^Yeah
column2: now that I think about it... Dashel... Dashel something... What was his name? FIST! Dashel Stonefist. They call him Fist in some circles--probably on account that he likes to get in brawls. You can find him in Old Town usually--right smack dab in the center of it. Go talk to him. If you have to
column3: use a sword or something heavy and blunt to persuade him to open up some. And don't hesitate. If he's in this as deep as these papers suggest
column4: then he's not going to give you any information willingly.

column1: The Missing Diplomat^31^Alliance^Stormwind City^Dashel Stonefist^Elling Trias^The Missing Diplomat^^^Speak to Elling Trias in Stormwind.^So yeah... um... I might know something 'bout that meeting at Addle's Stead. Happened a few weeks back I think. I really didn't have any part in it. Me part was done when plan A failed... damn adventurers. The guy we got on the inside for plan B came out of Menethil; guy called Slim. That's all I know regarding their backup plan.

The Missing Diplomat^33^Alliance^Stormwind City^Elling Trias^Mikhail^The Missing Diplomat^^^Speak to Mikhail in the Wetlands.^A contact of mine retired in the Wetlands at the harbor city of Menethil. He should be willing to help on your word alone if you tell him you're working for me. His name is Mikhail. He mentioned becoming a bartender before leaving Stormwind a few years ago. Speak to him
column2: find this Slim
column3: and find out if there's anything else to know about this kidnapped diplomat. We need to find out where they've taken him
column4: or at least who he is. The docket doesn't mention anything about their plans after he's captured.

column1: The Missing Diplomat^33^Alliance^Stormwind City^Mikhail^Mikhail^The Missing Diplomat^^The Missing Diplomat
column2: The Missing Diplomat^Subdue Tapoke Jahn before he escapes
column3: and then return to Mikhail in Menethil.^You say Elling sent you here? Well then
column4: the hospitality I expressed is now tenfold. Anything you need
column5: just ask. I will do my best to aid you. Hmm
column6: Slim
column7: you say? Not sure the name sounds familiar
column8: but I'll keep my eyes out for him. Don't look now
column9: <name>
column10: but the gentleman over by the exit is looking over here. He's listening to our conversation a little too intently if you catch my meaning? If I were you
column11: I'd do what you can to subdue him before he makes a break for the door.

column1: The Missing Diplomat^33^Alliance^Stormwind City^Tapoke "Slim" Jahn^Mikhail^The Missing Diplomat^The Missing Diplomat^^Speak to Mikhail in the Wetlands.^The Defias didn't pay me well enough to die for their cause. They took the king. Yeah
column2: the king of Stormwind
column3: not some lowly diplomat. He was on his way to Theramore to meet with Jaina Proudmore--it was a big deal apparently
column4: and a big secret. But it's not just the Defias that are involved. They're working with someone. I think they knew this was bigger than them. My part was just to get their man on board the king's ship while it was in the harbor. The guy's name was Hendel. That's all I know. I swear!

column1: The Black Shield^35^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Black Shield^Krog^The Black Shield^^^Bring the Blackened Iron Shield to Krog in Brackenwall Village.^An iron shield
column2: blackened by the fire that raged through the inn
column3: is affixed to the crumbling chimney
column4: one of the few remaining parts of the structure that once made up the Shady Rest Inn. The shield can be removed from the brick of the chimney.

column1: Lieutenant Paval Reethe^35^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Theramore Guard Badge^Captain Garran Vimes^Lieutenant Paval Reethe^^^Bring Reethe's Badge to Captain Garran Vimes in Theramore.^A glint of light on the ground catches your eye from underneath the rubble. Brushing away debris and ash caked onto the object reveals the insignia of a gold anchor on white enameled on the surface: the sign of Theramore. Underneath the anchor is embossed the name "Lieutenant Paval Reethe".
The Black Shield^35^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Black Shield^Captain Garran Vimes^The Black Shield^^^Bring the Blackened Iron Shield to Captain Garran Vimes in Theramore.^An iron shield
column2: blackened by the fire that raged through the inn
column3: is affixed to the crumbling chimney
column4: one of the few remaining parts of the structure that once made up the Shady Rest Inn. The shield can be removed from the brick of the chimney.

column1: ... and Bugs^40^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Morgan Stern^Morgan Stern^Morgan Stern^^Feast at the Blue Recluse^Bring 12 Pristine Crawler Legs to Morgan Stern in Theramore.^Another component of my new recipe is the shelled leg of a giant crab. And the crabs they have in Dustwallow -- Muckshells they call them -- just won't do! I'm afraid the only suitable crabs live far away
column2: in the Swamp of Sorrows. The shell of the crab leg is a key element of the dish's presentation so I need pristine
column3: unscarred legs. An adult crab might only have one or two such legs
column4: and I need a lot in order to research my dish. So
column5: <name>... are you willing to travel?

column1: Lieutenant Paval Reethe^40^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Captain Garran Vimes^Adjutant Tesoran^Lieutenant Paval Reethe^^^Find out more about Reethe from Adjutant Tesoran in Theramore.^I don't recognize the name of Lieutenant Paval Reethe. Your best bet would be to check with Adjutant Tesoran. He keeps track of all the records for the Theramore guard
column2: from personnel to their equipment. He should be able to tell you who this Reethe is with a quick check of his books.

column1: Morgan Stern^38^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Angus Stern^Morgan Stern^Morgan Stern^^^Speak with Morgan Stern in Theramore.^I'm developing a new menu for the restaurant. It will be filled with rural dishes with a "bayou" theme. I think my clientele at the Blue Recluse will love them! I sent my nephew Morgan to Theramore
column2: a city on the edge of the Dustwallow Marsh. He's there gathering recipes from the locals
column3: and I must know what he found so far. The trip to Theramore is long. Too long for me. But I bet a young <class> like yourself would jump at the chance to travel
column4: yes?

column1: Marg Speaks^40^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Bubbling Cauldron^Nazeer Bloodpike^Marg Speaks^The Troll Witchdoctor^^Bring the Jeweled Pendant to Nazeer in Brackenwall Village.^Cursed muckshell! You can't kill Marg! Ah
column2: but I am dead. So it must have slain me... But my mission! My mission! You
column3: <name>
column4: must complete it. While near Theramore
column5: I spied a group of Alliance soldiers camped on the beach. And one soldier wore a pendant... a pendant laden with more gems than any soldier could afford! That night I snuck into their camp and stole the pendant
column6: but on my return to base a muckshell crab-man killed me! <name>
column7: you must find that muckshell and recover the pendant!

column1: Report to Zor^40^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Nazeer Bloodpike^Zor Lonetree^Marg Speaks^^Service to the Horde^Bring the Jeweled Pendant to Zor Lonetree in Orgrimmar.^It is strange that the pendant Marg stole was in the hands of common soldiers. Perhaps its owner was in disguise
column2: or perhaps the soldiers themselves stole it! Regardless of which is true
column3: this is a noble's pendant and we must discover its true owner if we are to unravel its mystery. Take the pendant to Zor Lonetree in Orgrimmar. He is well schooled in Alliance politics
column4: and will know if this pendant has a history among the nobles of Stormwind.

column1: The Missing Diplomat^33^Alliance^Stormwind City^Mikhail^Commander Samaul^The Missing Diplomat^The Missing Diplomat^^Find Commander Samaul in Dustwallow Marsh.^The beginning of every month the Kul Tiras Marines all get paid and usually leave Theramore for somewhere else. A lot of them come here to womanize
column2: carouse
column3: and just have a good time. One of those groups I'd consider regulars here at the tavern
column4: and I believe this Hendel is among them. Commander Samaul in Theramore would be able to help you find him if Hendel's still stationed there. He's completely loyal to Proudmoore
column5: but if you drop Elling's name
column6: he should help you out... discreetly.

column1: The Missing Diplomat^35^Alliance^Stormwind City^Commander Samaul^Archmage Tervosh^The Missing Diplomat^^^Search Sentry Point for any sign of Private Hendel.^Hendel? Yes
column2: I know the man. But why would you need one of my soldiers? Elling sent you to find him? Hmm
column3: I don't like the sound of that. Elling wouldn't have you come to me first if your business wasn't troubling. I understand if you can't tell me what this is about
column4: but know this: I have a duty to protect these lands. If you're going to cause a disturbance
column5: then I suggest you inform me of whatever you can. I believe Hendel was stationed at the first tower outside of Theramore. Be cautious.

column1: The Missing Diplomat^36^Alliance^Stormwind City^Archmage Tervosh^Private Hendel^The Missing Diplomat^^The Missing Diplomat^Find Private Hendel in Dustwallow Marsh.^Private Hendel is to the west of here. He's currently on guard duty protecting some of Theramore's infiltrators while they rest. They've been keeping tabs on the Horde base
column2: Brackenwall
column3: and looking for anything else that might threaten our borders. You should have no problem finding him; just look for the tents along the road. I have another matter to attend to
column4: but I shall catch up to you soon enough. You can always find me in the Lady Proudmoore's tower if you have any problems.

column1: Suspicious Hoofprints^35^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Suspicious Hoofprint^Krog^^^^Report about the suspicious prints at the Shady Rest Inn to Krog in Brackenwall Village.^Rows of hoofprints lead away from the still-smoking skeleton of the Shady Rest Inn. There are at least a few visible impressions
column2: with more rows of prints almost imperceptible in the soft mud of the marsh.

column1: Lieutenant Paval Reethe^37^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Theramore Guard Badge^Krog^^^Questioning Reethe^Bring Reethe's Badge to Krog in Brackenwall Village.^A glint of light on the ground catches your eye from underneath the rubble. Brushing debris and ash caked onto the object reveals the insignia of a gold anchor on white
column2: enameled on the surface: the sign of Theramore. Underneath the anchor is embossed the name "Lieutenant Paval Reethe".

column1: Stinky's Escape^37^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^"Stinky" Ignatz^Mebok Mizzyrix^^^^Escort "Stinky" Ignatz
column2: then speak with Mebok Mizzyrix in Ratchet.^Great
column3: finally something that doesn't want to eat me!! I need help handling the critters around here
column4: and you fit the mold
column5: <buddy/lady>. A goblin from Ratchet named Mebok Mizzyrix needs some bogbean leaves for a potion
column6: or something... I honestly don't care why -- his money was good and I know this swamp
column7: so here I am. Too bad I got myself surrounded before I found the bogbean! Can you help me out of here
column8: and watch my back as I look for Mebok's plant?

column1: Questioning Reethe^37^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Ogron^Krog^^Lieutenant Paval Reethe^Return to Krog^Go with Ogron to speak with Reethe
column2: then return to Krog in Brackenwall Village.^It took a long time
column3: but I found Reethe. He hide good for a human. Ogron worried that he might be crazy after so much time in swamp. You come with me for we go get answers from him.

column1: The Missing Diplomat^28^Alliance^Stormwind City^Thomas^Bishop DeLavey^The Missing Diplomat^^^Find Bishop DeLavey in Stormwind Keep.^Excuse me
column2: <sir /madam>. Bishop DeLavey asked me to approach adventurers that might be able to help him with a delicate matter. If you could quietly head to Stormwind Keep and speak to him at your earliest convenience
column3: I'm sure he would appreciate your help. Again
column4: please be discreet. It is a matter of some importance.

column1: Researching the Corruption^24^Alliance^Blackfathom Deeps^Gershala Nightwhisper^Gershala Nightwhisper^The Corruption Abroad^^^Gershala Nightwhisper in Auberdine wants 8 Corrupt Brain stems.^Foolish blood elves toil with demonic magic. Have they not witnessed what happened with the naga and with the satyrs of Kalimdor? I fear that the blood elves will meet a similar deformation. Azeroth cannot afford to give birth to another vile race of monsters. I wish to study the brain stems of the satyr and naga so that I might deduce what fate the elves are headed toward. In Blackfathom Deeps
column2: on the coast of Ashenvale
column3: you will find both satyr and naga. 'Tis a long journey
column4: <name>.

column1: The Black Shield^37^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Krog^Mosarn^^The Black Shield^^Show the Blackened Iron Shield to Mosarn in Thunder Bluff.^Ah
column2: I remember now! Mosarn is a well-respected blacksmith in Thunder Bluff. I knew I had heard his name somewhere
column3: before. In thanks
column4: the Earthen Ring awarded me with a set of armor crafted by Mosarn. Very good work. Perhaps he can tell you more about the shield he crafted. It's not much of a lead
column5: but since we didn't get anything useful out of Reethe
column6: it's all we have.

column1: They Call Him Smiling Jim^35^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Guard Byron^Captain Garran Vimes^They Call Him Smiling Jim^^Inspecting the Ruins^Speak with Captain Garran Vimes on the top floor of Foothold Citadel.^I can't help it if I feel sorry for ol' Jim there. He wasn't always like that. Ran an inn out in the marsh for a while
column2: wonderful place. Look
column3: I don't really want to talk about it. Bring it up with Captain Vimes if you really have to. He's stationed on the top floor of Foothold Citadel
column4: the large barracks to the east of Lady Jaina's tower.

column1: Suspicious Hoofprints^35^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Suspicious Hoofprint^Captain Garran Vimes^^^^Report about the suspicious prints at the Shady Rest Inn to Captain Garran Vimes in Theramore.^Rows of hoofprints lead away from the still-smoking skeleton of the Shady Rest Inn. There are at least a few visible impressions
column2: with more rows of prints almost imperceptible in the soft mud of the marsh.

column1: Daelin's Men^38^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Adjutant Tesoran^Captain Garran Vimes^Lieutenant Paval Reethe^^^Return the information about Reethe to Captain Garran Vimes in Theramore.^Reddon... Redpath... Ah
column2: here it is! Lieutenant Paval Reethe. Joined the Theramore guard along with most of the recruits that came across the sea with Lady Proudmoore. Enlisted with the marines of Kul Tiras at the age of sixteen. Distinguished service
column3: promotions... Listed as missing.

column1: The Deserters^38^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Captain Garran Vimes^Balos Jacken^Lieutenant Paval Reethe^^^Get information about Reethe from Balos Jacken and the deserters in Dustwallow Marsh.^It has been a struggle maintaining a presence in the marsh
column2: but through strength of our resolve
column3: we have been able to maintain several defensive watchtowers throughout the area. The latest information and scouting reports I have received indicate that a group of deserters has squatted in our abandoned tower at Lost Point
column4: southeast of the inn. The local lieutenant seems to be Balos Jacken. See if you can get some information out of him. Be warned
column5: <name>. He may be a tough nut to crack.

column1: The Deserters^38^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Balos Jacken^Captain Garran Vimes^Lieutenant Paval Reethe^^A Grim Connection^Speak with Captain Garran Vimes in Theramore about Reethe.^Reethe? That coward? We threw him out of camp because he insisted on raiding the supplies of the ogres up at Brackenwall Village. We're not so many in number that we could stand up to those mindless brutes. He crossed the line one too many times
column2: so we left him to fend for himself. Now
column3: I helped you out... So
column4: why don't you help us out and forget you bumped into us?

column1: James Hyal^35^Alliance^Stormwind City^Connor Rivers^Vincent Hyal^James Hyal^^^Speak with Vincent Hyal in Menethil Harbor.^Before working here at the Blue Recluse
column2: I was trained by one of the best chefs and innkeepers I'd ever met. His name was James Hyal. Everything I have and everywhere I've gotten in life is thanks to him. I wonder how he's doing. His brother Vincent and he went to work in a tavern in Menethil Harbor
column3: but I haven't heard from him recently. If you ever happen to be headed in that direction
column4: maybe you could say hello to him for me?

column1: James Hyal^35^Alliance^Wetlands^Vincent Hyal^Clerk Lendry^James Hyal^^Inspecting the Ruins^Speak with Clerk Lendry at Foothold Citadel in Theramore.^My brother James went with Lady Proudmoore across the sea. Last I heard
column2: the fighting had settled down over there
column3: and James was setting up an inn somewhere on the continent. Wherever he is
column4: I'm sure he's doing good business. Damn fine cook he was. I haven't heard from him for a while now--too busy with his inn
column5: I'd wager--but the clerk in Theramore could probably point you to him. Look for him on the top floor of that keep near the middle of the city. What's it called... Foothold Citadel
column6: that's it.

column1: Unfinished Gordok Business^60^All^Dire Maul^Captain Kromcrush^Captain Kromcrush^^^^Find the Gauntlet of Gordok Might and return it to Captain Kromcrush in Dire Maul.^Now you da king
column2: so maybe you get prized Gordok artifact back from creepy elf who calls himself Prince! Da king before you failed
column3: just like all da other kings since Tortheldrin - da creepy elf - stole it from old timey Gordok king! Artifact is called da Gauntlet of Gordok Might. Old timey stories say only da one true king da Gordok can get it back. Old timey story also say creepy elf is still around here - you find it and it will become mighty gauntlet you wear forever! Yar
column4: I show you!

column1: The Black Shield^35^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Captain Garran Vimes^Caz Twosprocket^The Black Shield^^^Show the Blackened Iron Shield to Caz Twosprocket in Theramore.^I'm sorry I can't be of much help
column2: <name>
column3: but I can refer you to someone who would be. Caz Twosprocket
column4: one of our best blacksmiths
column5: works the forge at the smithy. Take the shield to him
column6: and see what he can tell you.

column1: The Black Shield^35^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Caz Twosprocket^Captain Garran Vimes^The Black Shield^^^Speak with Captain Garran Vimes in Theramore.^Ah
column2: I almost missed this... The leather strap on the back must have burned off
column3: but it seems like it was made to fit a large person. I'd guess a tauren
column4: actually. That's about all I can tell you. Tell Captain Vimes I'm sorry I couldn't be of more help.

column1: The Black Shield^35^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Krog^Do'gol^The Black Shield^^^Show the Blackened Iron Shield to Do'gol in Brackenwall Village.^Hmm... I don't see anything out of the ordinary with this shield. We should have Do'gol
column2: the blacksmith
column3: take a look at it
column4: and see if he can tell us more about it
column5: but I wouldn't hold out hope...

column1: The Black Shield^37^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Do'gol^Do'gol^The Black Shield^^^Acquire 5 Acidic Venom Sacs for Do'gol in Brackenwall Village.^Hmmm
column2: there's writing right here on the rim of the shield
column3: but it's hard to read from all the burned stuff. I need acid to make it clear. Venom from the darkmist spiders would do good. The spiders have taken over an old mine
column4: the Darkmist Cavern
column5: northwest of the village. Get me some of their sacs and I can clean this up.

column1: The Black Shield^37^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Do'gol^Krog^The Black Shield^^The Black Shield^Talk with Krog in Brackenwall Village.^Oh
column2: I think I might have dropped too much acid onto the shield. Let me just rub a little... Hm
column3: kind of hard to read
column4: but it looks like the name Mosarn. Never heard of him. Maybe Krog knows. Krog knows many people.

column1: The Missing Diplomat^38^Alliance^Stormwind City^Private Hendel^Archmage Tervosh^^The Missing Diplomat^The Missing Diplomat^Defeat Private Hendel in Dustwallow Marsh.^What?! You come here accusing me of allying with the Defias
column2: and think I'll just stand here while you insult me?! Something tells me you've had this coming for a long time.

column1: Stormpike's Order^14^Alliance^Loch Modan^Mountaineer Stormpike^Furen Longbeard^Mountaineer Stormpike's Task^^^Bring Stormpike's Request to Furen Longbeard in Stormwind.^There is a dwarven armorsmith whose work I admire greatly. His name is Furen Longbeard
column2: and his skill is unmatched. I need a new shield
column3: and I must have one of his! The problem is... Furen is far to the south
column4: in the dwarven district within Stormwind. In human lands! I can't imagine why he would live there
column5: so far from Ironforge. The humans must pay him a king's ransom to keep him there! So
column6: if you want to travel and don't mind making some money
column7: then will you send Furen my request for a shield?

column1: Mountaineer Stormpike's Task^15^Alliance^Loch Modan^Mountaineer Kadrell^Mountaineer Stormpike^Mountaineer Stormpike's Task^^^Speak with Mountaineer Stormpike.^I hear Mountaineer Stormpike is looking for a runner. Someone to do a little traveling for him. How about it? Are you the <race> for the job? If so
column2: then you'll find Stormpike at the top of the northern guard tower.

column1: Sample for Helbrim^15^All^Undercity^Apothecary Zinge^Apothecary Helbrim^Escorting Erland^^^Bring the Wolf Heart Sample to Apothecary Helbrim in the Barrens.^A colleague in Kalimdor
column2: Apothecary Helbrim
column3: is researching the effects of Lordaeron toxins on the beasts of Kalimdor. He would be very interested in a sample of the wolf hearts Renferrel sent me. Helbrim is stationed in the Barrens
column4: in a village known as the Crossroads. To reach him
column5: you must travel via zeppelin to the orc capital of Orgrimmar
column6: then travel south
column7: by foot
column8: to Durotar. Head west into the Barrens
column9: and you will soon reach the Crossroads.

column1: Zinge's Delivery^15^All^Undercity^Apothecary Renferrel^Apothecary Zinge^Escorting Erland^^^Bring the Wolf Heart Samples to Apothecary Zinge in the Undercity.^The wolf hearts you acquired possess a quality unseen in similar specimens. There is a toxicity to them that should be deadly to the very wolves in which the hearts beat! It's quite incredible
column2: and we must study it further. I kept a few samples of the hearts acquired. Take them to my colleague
column3: Apothecary Zinge. You will find her in our headquarters in the Undercity.

column1: Reclaimed Treasures^43^Alliance^Ironforge^Krom Stoutarm^Krom Stoutarm^^^^Get Krom Stoutarm's treasured possession from his chest in the North Common Hall of Uldaman
column2: and bring it to him in Ironforge.^I had myself a fine job as a digger at the Uldaman excavation site in the Badlands... that is until those blasted troggs showed up. I escaped with my hide barely intact
column3: and nothing else. In the chaos
column4: I left my most treasured possession. It's safe from the troggs in my chest
column5: sure
column6: but it's right in the thick of 'em. I'd be in your debt
column7: both in honor and coin
column8: if you could fetch it for me! A chest with my name on it is at the end of the North Common Hall. That's the one you need to get in.

column1: Regthar Deathgate^32^Horde^Desolace^Krusk^Regthar Deathgate^Regthar Deathgate^^^Speak with Regthar Deathgate in the Barrens.^A warrior of the Horde
column2: Regthar Deathgate
column3: is recruiting agents for a mission into the land of Desolace. Speak with him if you wish to volunteer. He is stationed in the Barrens
column4: in a series of bunkers west of the Crossroads. And sharpen your weapons. Desolace is a place torn by war.

column1: The Kolkar of Desolace^32^Horde^Desolace^Regthar Deathgate^Felgur Twocuts^Regthar Deathgate^^^Speak with Felgur Twocuts at Ghost Walker Post in Desolace.^The Kolkar centaur live in Desolace
column2: and their forces have spread into the Barrens. This is a known fact and we have Horde agents dealing with them here. But as long as the centaur are strong in Desolace
column3: they will always pose a threat. It is time we rid ourselves of that threat. Speak with Felgur Twocuts at Ghost Walker Post in Desolace. He was sent to gather intelligence on the centaur. He will know how to best deal with the Kolkar of Desolace.

column1: Mazen's Behest^41^Alliance^Stormwind City^Mazen Mac'Nadir^Acolyte Dellis^Mazen's Behest^^^Speak with Acolyte Dellis in Stormwind.^As caretaker of the works here in the library of the Academy of Arcane Arts and Sciences
column2: it is my responsibility to ensure all the magical tomes and scrolls are accounted for at all times. Who knows what folly would unfold if some of these enchanted texts were to fall into the wrong hands? Which reminds me... my assistant
column3: Dellis
column4: made a horrible mistake last week. He's quite able in the library but incompetent when he leaves the gates of Stormwind. Be a hero
column5: and help old Dellis out
column6: would you?

column1: Mazen's Behest^41^Alliance^Stormwind City^Acolyte Dellis^Watcher Mahar Ba^Mazen's Behest^^^Retrieve Khadgar's Essays on Dimensional Convergence and deliver them to Watcher Mahar Ba in Nethergarde Keep.^Master Mazen's directions were quite clear: Deliver a very important essay to Watcher Mahar Ba in Nethergarde Keep. But I had never been to the Blasted Lands before! The journey was frightening! When I got to the Swamp of Sorrows
column2: I made a wrong turn and ended up surrounded by horrible plant-like swamp creatures. They lurched as if to attack me so I ran. But in my haste I dropped the essay. One of the beasts took it I am sure. Could you please try to retrieve it and deliver it to Mahar Ba?

column1: Khan Dez'hepah^35^Horde^Desolace^Felgur Twocuts^Felgur Twocuts^^^Centaur Bounty^Bring Khan Dez'hepah's Head to Felgur Twocuts in Desolace.^The Kolkar are not the only centaur of Desolace. Many clans wander these dry plains
column2: fighting and dying against each other. And it is good that they fight among themselves
column3: for they are strong and brutal. If the centaur united against us
column4: they would be a fierce foe. We must deal with them before they unite. Your first task is to disrupt the Kolkar clan. Do this by killing its leader
column5: Khan Dez'hepah. The Kolkar Village is northeast of here. Go
column6: and may fortune go with you.

column1: Centaur Bounty^31^Horde^Desolace^Felgur Twocuts^Felgur Twocuts^^Khan Dez'hepah^^Bring 15 Centaur Ears to Felgur Twocuts in Desolace.^Now that you scared the centaur clans
column2: it's time to bleed them. When traveling Desolace
column3: hunt centaur. I don't care which clan you hunt. Just gather ears. A hoard of ears. By weakening their numbers you will weaken their resolve
column4: and stamp out any thoughts of expansion. Good hunting
column5: <name>.

column1: Magram Alliance^33^Horde^Desolace^Gurda Wildmane^Warug^Magram Alliance^^Broken Tears^Gain a Friendly reputation with the Magram
column2: then speak with Warug.^To beat the centaur
column3: we must use their hatred against them. We will ally with one of the clans and through them
column4: we will learn how to defeat all the clans. If you choose to ally with the Magram then slay their foes
column5: the Gelkis. This will earn you respect among the Magram. When you earn enough
column6: then meet with the Magram spokesman Warug
column7: on the outskirts of the Magram Village
column8: in southeast Desolace.

column1: Gelkis Alliance^33^Horde^Desolace^Gurda Wildmane^Uthek the Wise^Gelkis Alliance^^Stealing Supplies^Gain a Friendly reputation with the Gelkis
column2: then speak with Uthek the Wise.^To beat the centaur
column3: we must use their hatred against them. We will ally with one of the clans and through them
column4: we will learn how to defeat all the clans. If you choose to ally with the Gelkis then slay their most hated rival
column5: the Magram. After you earn the respect of the Gelkis
column6: meet with the Gelkis shaman Uthek the Wise
column7: on the outskirts of the Gelkis Village
column8: in southwest Desolace.

column1: Broken Tears^33^All^Desolace^Warug^Warug^Magram Alliance^^^Maintain your reputation with the Magram
column2: and bring 3 Broken Tears to Warug in the Magram Village.^The Gelkis think our centaur mother
column3: Theradras
column4: protects us. They are stupid. No one protects the centaur. The Magram do not need protection! We are the strongest! Show the Gelkis they are stupid. Go to the cave in their village. They hoard crystals in that cave
column5: the tears of Theradras. Destroy the tears and bring me the broken pieces!

column1: Stealing Supplies^35^All^Desolace^Uthek the Wise^Uthek the Wise^Gelkis Alliance^^^Bring 6 bags of Crudely Dried Meat to Uthek the Wise in the Gelkis Village.^When we are not at war
column2: we hunt for meat. Meat gives us strength
column3: and full bellies fight harder than empty ones. It is the same with the Magram. They store extra meat so they may fight longer between hunts. If you raid their village to the east and take their stores of meat
column4: then their strength will fail.

column1: Gizmo for Warug^35^All^Desolace^Warug^Warug^Magram Alliance^^Khan Shaka^Maintain your reputation with the Magram
column2: and bring an Advanced Target Dummy to Warug in the Magram Village in Desolace.^Long ago
column3: a little gnome came to Desolace. He had horses and a cart
column4: and the cart held strange things. Funny things. Things that burned different colors. Things that moved and weren't alive. I killed the little gnome
column5: but before that... he made me laugh. I kept my favorite thing from his cart. It was a human made of wood and it waved at me until I hit it and broke it. I want a new one. Get me a new one!

column1: Nothing But The Truth^42^Horde^Duskwood^Deathstalker Zraedus^Apothecary Faustin^Nothing But The Truth^^^Speak with Apothecary Faustin at Beggar's Haunt.^Our expeditionary force was sent at Varimathras's behest to survey lower Azeroth. While out scouting I noticed a human Infiltrator spying on Beggar's Haunt. Before I could apprehend him
column2: some of our orcish... brethren... captured him and took him to Stonard
column3: their stronghold in Swamp of Sorrows. I want to... help... our orcish allies. They did not see our camp here but nonetheless I want to lend a hand. Work with Faustin here to develop a... truth serum for our friend in Stonard.

column1: Ongeku^37^All^Desolace^Uthek the Wise^Uthek the Wise^Gelkis Alliance^^^Maintain your reputation with the Gelkis
column2: and bring a Draenethyst Shard to Uthek the Wise in the Gelkis Village in Desolace.^You have more to prove
column3: and your next task will take you far
column4: so for now the Gelkis will fight the Magram without you. The earth whispers many secrets to those who listen. One secret I hear is of a red crystal. It is called draenethyst
column5: and it is new to our earth. It comes from a place where mountains fly
column6: and where demons rule. Bring me a shard of draenethyst
column7: and it will make my magic strong! The shard is in a place called the Swamp of Sorrows
column8: held by the lost one Ongeku.

column1: Khan Jehn^37^All^Desolace^Uthek the Wise^Uthek the Wise^Gelkis Alliance^^^Bring the Khan Jehn's Head to Uthek the Wise in the Gelkis Village in Desolace.^The earth speaks to me
column2: and it says that the Magram grow weak. Now it is time to kill their Khan! Bring me the head of the Magram Khan
column3: Jehn!

column1: Khan Shaka^37^All^Desolace^Warug^Warug^Khan Shaka^Gizmo for Warug^^Maintain your reputation with the Magram
column2: and bring the Head of Khan Shaka to Warug in the Magram Village in Desolace.^You help the Magram
column3: and I like you. Now
column4: kill the Khan of the Gelkis! He is Khan Shaka
column5: and I want his head! I want to stare at his head and laugh at him!

column1: Khan Hratha^42^All^Desolace^Uthek the Wise^Uthek the Wise^Gelkis Alliance^^^Maintain your reputation with the Gelkis
column2: and bring the Maraudine Key Fragment to Uthek the Wise in the Gelkis Village.^<name>
column3: you helped us against the Magram. Now
column4: help us beat the Maraudine! Kill the head of their clan
column5: Khan Hratha! To face him
column6: blow the Maraudine War Horn. It is atop a high bluff in the Valley of Spears. But to blow the horn
column7: you must gain a warhorn mouthpiece. These are rare
column8: carried only by trusted Maraudine centaur. After the horn is blown
column9: centaur will come. Kill them until Hratha appears. Khan Hratha holds the piece of... a key. Bring it to me...

column1: Khan Hratha^42^All^Desolace^Warug^Warug^Khan Shaka^^^Maintain your Magram reputation
column2: and bring the Maraudine Key Fragment to Warug in the Magram Village in Desolace.^The Gelkis Khan is dead
column3: and now the Maraudine will fall! Kill the Maraudine Khan
column4: Hratha! To face him
column5: blow the horn on the high bluff in the Valley of Spears. But to blow the horn
column6: you need a mouthpiece. To get a mouthpiece
column7: kill Maraudine centaur. Keep killing until you find a mouthpiece. Then blow the horn. Do this and Maraudine centaur will come to the tower. Kill them until Khan Hratha appears. Hratha holds the piece of a key. Give this piece to me...

column1: Strange Alliance^35^Alliance^Desolace^Captain Pentigast^Uthek the Wise^Strange Alliance^^^Gain a Friendly reputation with the Gelkis
column2: then speak with Uthek the Wise.^We are fortunate the centaur clans fight among themselves
column3: for if they joined into a single force then they would be unstoppable. Yes
column4: we are fortunate
column5: and we should press our advantage. One of the centaur clans
column6: the Gelkis clan
column7: is in brutal war with the Magram clan. If we attack the Magram
column8: then perhaps an alliance may be struck with the Gelkis. Speak with Uthek the Wise
column9: in the outskirts of the Gelkis camps in southwestern Desolace. Through her we might strike an alliance with the Gelkis.

column1: Nothing But The Truth^42^Horde^Duskwood^Apothecary Faustin^Apothecary Faustin^Nothing But The Truth^^Nothing But The Truth^Apothecary Faustin at Beggar's Haunt needs 5 Shadow Panther Hearts
column2: Mire Lord Fungus and some Green Whelp Blood.^I have just the right serum in mind. It will deal with the truth in precisely the way the truth should be dealt with. For this concoction I will need several Shadow Panther hearts from the Swamp. I also require the enchanted fungus off of the Mire Lord who resides there. I am sure one as able as you
column3: <name>
column4: can persuade him to part with some. The last item I'll need for the serum is the blood of a dreaming whelp
column5: like the ones that live outside Itharius' cave in the swamp. Now
column6: off you go!

column1: Raid on the Kolkar^32^Alliance^Desolace^Uthek the Wise^Uthek the Wise^Strange Alliance^^Stealing Supplies^Maintain your reputation with the Gelkis
column2: and bring 10 Crude Charms to Uthek the Wise in the Gelkis Village in Desolace.^The Kolkar centaurs think their magic is strong. They do not know magic! They would not know magic if it bit them! You will show them their magic is weak. Go to the Kolkar to the northeast and kill them. Take their charms. Bring me the charms and I will throw them in the fire and laugh!

column1: Brutal Politics^35^Alliance^Desolace^Captain Pentigast^Warug^Brutal Politics^^^Gain a Friendly reputation with the Magram
column2: then speak with Warug.^Desolace is a land at war. The centaurs wage war with each other
column3: and we believe the victor among them will spill out and threaten our strongholds. That
column4: we cannot allow We must learn how to beat the centaurs
column5: and to do that... we must ally with one of the clans. The Magram centaurs war with the Gelkis. If you fight the Gelkis then the Magram might consider an alliance. Earn the favor of the Magrams then speak with Warug
column6: in the Magram village in southeastern Desolace.

column1: Assault on the Kolkar^32^Alliance^Desolace^Warug^Warug^Brutal Politics^^Broken Tears^Maintain your reputation with the Magram. Kill 12 Kolkar Centaurs
column2: 12 Kolkar Scouts and 6 Kolkar Maulers
column3: then return to Warug in the Magram Village in Desolace.^The Kolkar think they are strong
column4: but we laugh at them! We laugh and we kill them! You kill them too. Show me you can kill Kolkar like we do. Head north and slay them all!

column1: Centaur Bounty^31^Alliance^Desolace^Corporal Melkins^Corporal Melkins^^^^Bring 15 Centaur Ears to Corporal Melkins at Nijel's Point in Desolace.^Many clans make up the centaur race. Each has its own leader and agenda
column2: but all the clans have one thing in common. Cruelty. If we are to ever find peace
column3: then the centaurs must be removed. And so I put you on the task to do just that. While wandering Desolace
column4: hunt centaur and take their ears. Bring me many
column5: many ears. Do this in service of the Alliance
column6: <name>
column7: and we will be one step closer to war's end.

column1: Nothing But The Truth^42^Horde^Duskwood^Apothecary Faustin^Deathstalker Zraedus^Nothing But The Truth^Nothing But The Truth^^Give Faustin's Truth Serum to Deathstalker Zraedus at Beggar's Haunt.^Everything is proceeding according to plan
column2: <name>. I want you to give this truth serum to Deathstalker Zraedus and he'll show you how to administer it.... properly. Haha!

column1: Draenethyst Crystals^35^All^Swamp of Sorrows^Magtoor^Magtoor^^^^Bring 6 Draenethyst crystals to Magtoor at The Harborage in the Swamp of Sorrows.^The lost ones who live in the Fallow Sanctuary look as we look
column2: but they are monsters... driven mad by the rigors of our journey to Azeroth. Once our brethren
column3: they now live in the Fallow Sanctuary to the east
column4: catching or killing any who wander near. And they have stolen something sacred to us--draenethyst crystals. We lack the force to enter the Fallow Sanctuary and reclaim our stolen draenethyst from among their huts and campfires
column5: but without those crystals... we too may lose our way.

column1: Nothing But The Truth^42^Horde^Duskwood^Deathstalker Zraedus^Infiltrator Marksen^Nothing But The Truth^^^Take Zraedus's Brew to Infiltrator Marksen in Stonard.^We need to operate with a certain amount of discretion. After all
column2: it's not like you're going to waltz in there and convince the fool to drink Faustin's concoction here
column3: right? But if there's one thing those humans cannot deny it's the booze. I'll take Faustin's serum and mix it into this ale. I guarantee the poor sap will show no reluctance when it comes to chug-a-lugging a brew. Make haste to Stonard in the Swamp of Sorrows
column4: <name>. And keep our little mission nice and quiet...

column1: Noboru the Cudgel^39^All^Swamp of Sorrows^Noboru's Cudgel^Magtoor^^^^Bring Noboru's Cudgel to the leader of The Harborage in the Swamp of Sorrows.^Noboru has plagued the Draenei of the Harborage for months
column2: and his cudgel is a symbol of the brutality they have suffered at the hands of the lost ones.

column1: Galen's Escape^38^Alliance^Swamp of Sorrows^Galen Goodward^Galen's Strongbox^^^^Escort Galen out of danger
column2: then find his camp in the Swamp of Sorrows and open his strongbox.^Please help! These creatures are going to eat me! Help me out of here
column3: and I'll give you a great treasure! It's in my camp in the swamp north of Stonard
column4: but it's locked in a strongbox that can be opened through a trick that only I know. If you help me escape
column5: then I'll teach it to you.

column1: Final Passage^36^Horde^Thousand Needles^Parqual Fintallas^Dorn Plainstalker^Test of Faith^^^Speak to Dorn Plainstalker in Thousand Needles.^You have done well
column2: <name>. You have passed my test
column3: and the tests before mine. Return to Dorn in Thousand Needles. He will sense the change within you
column4: and see that your mind
column5: body and spirit are strong enough that you should be rewarded for your efforts. Stay true to the balance you've shown throughout these trials
column6: <name>. Dorn will test you again in the future if you do.

column1: Supplies for Nethergarde^45^Alliance^Duskwood^Watchmaster Sorigal^Quartermaster Lungertz^Vital Supplies^^^Bring the Crate of Powerstones to Quartermaster Lungertz
column2: before the powerstones expire.^This crate of powerstones needs to go to Nethergarde Keep
column3: in the Blasted Lands. They won't hold their power for long
column4: so we can't ship them with the next caravan. You must take them
column5: and you must take them quickly. Bring them to Quartermaster Lungertz in Nethergarde Keep. To reach the keep
column6: you must travel east through Deadwind Pass
column7: then east through the Swamp of Sorrows
column8: then south through the Blasted Lands. Use caution
column9: <name>. You will travel through dangerous lands
column10: yet you must not fail.

column1: Encroaching Wildlife^37^Alliance^Swamp of Sorrows^Watcher Biggs^Watcher Biggs^Help Watcher Biggs^^^Kill 8 Young Sawtooth Crocolisks
column2: 10 Sorrow Spinners and 10 Swamp Jaguars then return to Watcher Biggs in the Swamp of Sorrows.^My caravan was destined for the eastern coast
column3: but we did not reach our goal. Lost Ones attacked us
column4: killing guards and dashing supplies. I alone survived their assault. I have sworn to protect what supplies remain
column5: but wild creatures skulk near. Please
column6: help me defend my camp from the beasts!

column1: Driftwood^42^Alliance^Swamp of Sorrows^Watcher Biggs^Watcher Biggs^Help Watcher Biggs^^^Bring 8 pieces of Sundried Driftwood to Watcher Biggs in the Swamp of Sorrows.^I owe you greatly
column2: <name>. An honorable heart beats within you. And now I have another task for which I humbly ask your aid. If I'm ever to reach Nethergarde
column3: then I must fix this wagon. And for that... I will need wood. Strong
column4: dry wood--not the spongy
column5: tangled wood of the swamp's trees. <name>
column6: go east to the coast and search for driftwood that has been dried by the sun. Bring it to me.

column1: Neeka Bloodscar^35^Horde^Swamp of Sorrows^Helgrum the Swift^Neeka Bloodscar^Neeka Bloodscar^^^Speak with Neeka Bloodscar.^The Badlands is harsh and lies close to the Alliance-held land of Loch Modan
column2: so communication between Stonard and the Badlands outpost of Kargath is often cut. Prove yourself
column3: <name>. Travel to the Badlands and speak with Neeka Bloodscar
column4: head scout of the Kargath outpost. Speak with her
column5: and then send her report back to me.

column1: Coyote Thieves^40^Horde^Badlands^Neeka Bloodscar^Neeka Bloodscar^^^^Bring 30 Coyote Jawbones to Neeka Bloodscar in Kargath.^Have you spent many days in the Badlands
column2: <class>? Have you felt its heat? Have you faced the beasts that wander its dusty plains? It's time you did. Crag coyotes are a tough breed. Tough
column3: and bold enough to creep into Kargath and steal from our food supplies. Help rid the outpost of these thieves! Hunt crag coyotes
column4: <name>. Hunt them and bring me their jawbones. Bring me enough
column5: and maybe I'll believe it when you say you know the Badlands.

column1: Report to Helgrum^40^Horde^Badlands^Neeka Bloodscar^Helgrum the Swift^Neeka Bloodscar^^^Bring Neeka's Report to Helgrum the Swift in Stonard.^I wrote a fresh report for Helgrum in Stonard. Bring it to him. And if you consider yourself an outrunner
column2: then don't lose your way. Or fall to an enemy.

column1: The Lost Caravan^35^Alliance^Swamp of Sorrows^Watcher Biggs^Watcher Biggs^Help Watcher Biggs^^^Find the Caravan Chest in the Fallow Sanctuary
column2: obtain the Wizards' Reagents and bring to Watcher Biggs.^I was stunned during the attack by the Lost Ones
column3: but before my sight went black I spied one of our wagons being dragged to the Fallow Sanctuary
column4: the lost one village to the north. A caravan chest with valuable reagents was in that wagon
column5: reagents vital to the studies of the wizards of Nethergarde Keep. Find the chest and get those reagents
column6: <name>. Get them and bring them to me.

column1: Threat From the Sea^45^Horde^Swamp of Sorrows^Tok'Kar^Katar^Lack of Surplus^^^Speak to Katar in the Swamp of Sorrows.^While I begin work on your weapon
column2: why don't you talk to Katar? He mentioned needing help with patrols along the beach
column3: and I'd rather see you keep your wits and weapons prepared instead of getting drunk with some of the other louses I share this camp with.

column1: The Lost Supplies^40^Alliance^Swamp of Sorrows^Lost Supplies^Quartermaster Lungertz^^^^Bring the Lost Supplies to Quartermaster Lungertz.^This barrel is small yet sturdy. Its seams are sealed with a yellow
column2: pungent wax. Stamped on the bottom of the barrel are the words: QUARTERMASTER LUNGERTZ NETHERGARDE KEEP

column1: Pool of Tears^43^Horde^Swamp of Sorrows^Fel'zerul^Fel'zerul^Pool of Tears^^^Fel'zerul in Stonard wants you to gather 5 Atal'ai Artifacts.^The Warchief sent us to investigate strange happenings at The Temple of Atal'Hakkar. The Atal'ai trolls are a tribe of dark casters
column2: known for practicing forbidden magic. You can imagine how astonished we were when we arrived here to discover the temple had been sunk. The green dragons now guard the site
column3: claiming to be protectors of Azeroth. We need to discover what happened. Explore around the Pool of Tears and gather Atal'ai artifacts. From those I can begin to piece together this puzzle.

column1: Deliver the Shipment^42^Alliance^Swamp of Sorrows^Watcher Biggs^Quartermaster Lungertz^Help Watcher Biggs^^^Bring the Shipment to Nethergarde to Quartermaster Lungertz in Nethergarde Keep.^While I fix this wagon
column2: <name>
column3: I have one last task for you. I have packed the most vital supplies saved from the ogre attacks. Take them to Nethergarde Keep. The keep is nestled in the northern hills of the Blasted Lands
column4: keeping watch over the Dark Portal. To reach Nethergard
column5: follow the road east. When it branches head south into the Blasted Lands
column6: then turn left at the next fork. Follow the road
column7: <name>
column8: and be wary.

column1: Threat From the Sea^43^Horde^Swamp of Sorrows^Katar^Katar^Lack of Surplus^^^Kill 10 Marsh Murlocs
column2: 10 Marsh Inkspewer
column3: and 10 Marsh Flesheater
column4: then return to Katar in the Swamp of Sorrows.^I have no love for the sea
column5: nor any creature I've seen come from its depths. It is a powerful but blind mistress; callous and brutal. It would bring me great pleasure to slay the fish men by the hundreds if it were within my power. But I garner some pleasure from watching their deaths at the hands of any who do the Horde's will. Which brings us to you
column6: <class>. How many can you slay? Would you test yourself against their most powerful kind?

column1: Threat From the Sea^43^Horde^Swamp of Sorrows^Katar^Tok'Kar^Lack of Surplus^^Continued Threat^Speak with Tok'Kar in the Swamp of Sorrows.^Before you take rest
