column2: speak to Tok'Kar again. While you were gone I believe he finished a few weapons. For your help here
column3: he would offer one of them to you. You would do well to test its strength against the fish men when you are ready... but only to please me further.

column1: Continued Threat^45^Horde^Swamp of Sorrows^Katar^Katar^^Threat From the Sea^^Kill 10 Marsh Inkspewers
column2: 10 Marsh Flesheaters
column3: and 10 Marsh Oracles
column4: then return to Katar in the Swamp of Sorrows.^It pleases me to see your hatred for the fish men grows with mine. Find more of their kind along the beach
column5: and when you've had your fill of combat
column6: return to me. We shall speak then of a reward for your diligence.

column1: The Atal'ai Exile^44^Horde^Swamp of Sorrows^Fel'zerul^Atal'ai Exile^Pool of Tears^^^Bring the Bundle of Atal'ai Artifacts to the Atal'ai Exile in the Hinterlands.^While you were braving the dangers of the Pool of Tears
column2: one of my scouts returned with a scroll written in blood on dried flesh. It seems to be a judicial sentence against a priest of the Atal'ai tribe. This priest was sentenced to a fate worse than death amongst the Atal'ai. He was exiled to live far north in the Hinterlands
column3: with the Witherbark trolls. I will bundle these artifacts. You are to seek out the exile and discover their true use. Return to me once your journey is complete.

column1: Fresh Meat^44^Horde^Swamp of Sorrows^Dar^Dar^^^^Bring 10 Monstrous Crawler Legs to Dar in the Swamp of Sorrows.^There's a high demand for the succulent taste of crawler meat among my customers; especially the meat from the monstrous crawlers. If you plan on heading to the coast
column2: then I could easily make it worth your while to bring me back some of their legs to have transported back to Orgrimmar. The coast is to the east from here
column3: and you should have no problem finding the creatures scurrying along the beaches and under the sea.

column1: Alliance Relations^30^All^Orgrimmar^Craven Drok^Keldran^Alliance Relations^^^Speak to Keldran in Orgrimmar.^Be still
column2: <class>
column3: and allow me to share with you something important to our people
column4: but far from obvious. We are a proud race
column5: and the war with the humans tried even Thrall's great patience. You see
column6: our Warchief is wise and prudent
column7: and he continues to put his people first. Ultimately
column8: he is a diplomat
column9: and in his time with the humans he learned much of their ways. If the tale I've started piques your interest
column10: then find Keldran near the western exit of the city. His hovel is there.

column1: Alliance Relations^30^All^Orgrimmar^Keldran^Takata Steelblade^Alliance Relations^^Alliance Relations^Speak to Takata Steelblade in Desolace.^As the Alliance progresses deeper and deeper into Kalimdor
column2: incorrect conclusions may be drawn about the Horde making pacts with the Burning Legion. The Warchief cannot allow that to happen. And with his blessing
column3: I am taking control of overseeing them removed. I have agents in the area of Desolace at the Ghost Walker Post north of the great Kodo Graveyard. Head south of the Charred Vale in the Stonetalon Mountains and you shall come across it. When you arrive
column4: seek out Takata Steelblade.

column1: Alliance Relations^33^Horde^Orgrimmar^Takata Steelblade^Maurin Bonesplitter^Alliance Relations^Alliance Relations^^Speak to Maurin Bonesplitter in Desolace.^The Burning Blade have many agendas
column2: but know that they are evil to their core
column3: their spirits corrupted
column4: and their destruction is the only way to thwart their objectives. Keldran sent Maurin with me because of his knowledge of the Blade and their warlock ways. He has control of our plots against the Blade while I deal with the other demonic threats here in Desolace. Speak to him
column5: and he will guide you in his designs.

column1: Befouled by Satyr^33^Horde^Orgrimmar^Takata Steelblade^Takata Steelblade^^^^Slay 7 Hatefury Rogues
column2: 7 Hatefury Felsworn
column3: 7 Hatefury Betrayers
column4: and 7 Hatefury Hellcallers
column5: and return to Takata Steelblade in Desolace.^A demon infestation does not occur without other influences--something else allows evil to gain a foothold. It may start with a weakened spirit
column6: a needless desire for power; perhaps it's a thirst for revenge
column7: or the appeal for final justice. When we are beset by pain
column8: evil takes advantage of us--evil such as the satyr. Ties have been made between them and the Burning Blade
column9: and Thrall would have them slain. Seek them out to the northeast of here
column10: and return to me when you've driven them back.

column1: The Burning of Spirits^33^Horde^Orgrimmar^Maurin Bonesplitter^Maurin Bonesplitter^Alliance Relations^^Alliance Relations^Return the Burning Gem and 15 Infused Burning Gems to Maurin Bonesplitter in Desolace.^Death is most desirable for those despicable creatures that turn their back on their liege for such selfish reasons. But death is not enough when dealing with those that have given themselves over to the darkness. Take this gem. When one of the Burning Blade's near death
column2: activate its magic. The spell shall pull the corrupted spirit out of its victim
column3: leaving an infused gem behind. Bring me these infused gems so I may dispose of them properly. Go now
column4: and may you elude death.

column1: Alliance Relations^33^Horde^Orgrimmar^Takata Steelblade^Keldran^^The Burning of Spirits^^Speak to Keldran in Orgrimmar.^The fight goes well
column2: <name>. Perhaps the Warchief will allow us to return to our homes before the seasons change if we continue to make such great strides in our battle against the demons and their underlings. Return to Keldran and let him know what we have done. I am sure he will reward you for your efforts here. His cause is important to him
column3: and he will take pride in knowing that the Warchief respects his concerns.

column1: Vahlarriel's Search^33^Alliance^Desolace^Vahlarriel Demonslayer^Malem Chest^Vahlarriel's Search^^^Find and search Tyranis and Dalinda Malem's wagon in Desolace.^I am Vahlarriel
column2: <name>. I've come here to discover the whereabouts of two missing nobles of a Darnassian merchant family--House Malem. The father of the house fears the worst
column3: and I am to do everything I can to find his missing children. I have yet to start my search for Tyranis or Dalinda
column4: but I am hopeful I shall not be here long. Last word tells of them passing through the Stonetalon Mountains a few weeks ago. If you find their wagon
column5: please
column6: come find me immediately.

column1: Vahlarriel's Search^33^Alliance^Desolace^Vahlarriel Demonslayer^Dalinda Malem^Vahlarriel's Search^^^Find Dalinda Malem in Desolace.^Find both Dalinda and Tyranis if you can and come back to me with your findings. Start your search at this fortress. I will contact my superiors in Darnassus immediately and let them know the situation. <name>
column2: there is something else I wish to impress upon you. My superiors have shown some concern over Tyranis' and his motives for coming here. It is more important to them that Dalinda is found and brought back safely. Tyranis is to be... gauged before he is taken home.

column1: Search for Tyranis^33^Alliance^Desolace^Dalinda Malem^Dalinda Malem^Vahlarriel's Search^^Return to Vahlarriel^Find Tyranis Malem in Desolace.^We were brought here after the orcs slaughtered all our guards and servants. Oh
column2: the terrible things they did to them! I thought surely they would kill us right there and then
column3: but it became obvious they had other plans. Tyranis attempted to speak to them. I think he wanted to impress them with his knowledge of the arcane... I'm not sure why. Please
column4: I can't leave here until I know what's happened to my brother. Find him
column5: then come back for me when his fate is known.

column1: Return to Vahlarriel^33^Alliance^Desolace^Dalinda Malem^Vahlarriel Demonslayer^^Search for Tyranis^^Escort Dalinda Malem from Thunder Axe Fortress and then return to Vahlarriel Demonslayer in Desolace.^So
column2: the time is now then? I appreciate your efforts
column3: and if the situation does not lend itself
column4: then allow me to thank you now for everything you've done for me and my family. If you're ready
column5: then there is nothing else for me here--we can leave when you feel the time is right.

column1: Seeking the Kor Gem^22^Alliance^Paladin^Thundris Windweaver^Thundris Windweaver^^The Test of Righteousness^^Bring a Kor Gem to Thundris Windweaver in Darkshore.^Greetings
column2: <name>. What can I do for one who follows a holy path? Ah
column3: yes
column4: Stilwell
column5: the blacksmith... from long ago. I remember him well
column6: though
column7: I have not heard his name in some time. He never struck me as an impudent man
column8: so I can only assume his desire for a Kor gem is noble. If you truly wish for one of the gems
column9: then you must head to the northwest of Ashenvale. You will find Blackfathom Deeps there within some ancient ruins. The naga who still use the gems are down below. Do not go alone
column10: <class>.

column1: Return to Fel'Zerul^44^Horde^The Hinterlands^Atal'ai Exile^Fel'zerul^Pool of Tears^^^Return to Fel'Zerul in Stonard.^Jammal'an the Prophet sentenced me to exile from The Temple of Atal'Hakkar. I once felt the high priest was a worthy leader. His unyielding faith in his prophecy will bring about the destruction of the Atal'ai. If it hasn't already. When I expressed my concerns
column2: I was labeled an infidel and ousted from the temple. Those artifacts you brought to me are harmless. But if Jammal'an has found the proper fetish enchantment for the summoning ritual
column3: the world lies in great peril....

column1: The Temple of Atal'Hakkar^50^All^Swamp of Sorrows^Fel'zerul^Fel'zerul^Pool of Tears^^^Collect 20 Fetishes of Hakkar and bring them to Fel'Zerul in Stonard.^So he spoke of Jammal'an's prophecy? The Atal'ai spiritual leader believes once Hakkar returns to Azeroth from the Nether
column2: the god will grant the Atal'ai tribe immortality. Foolish trickery to bring about a premature doomsday if you ask me. But you say the exile spoke of enchanted fetishes? This concerns me greatly. If these are in fact the key to the Atal'ai ritual which caused this mess
column3: we must understand their intrinsic powers. Venture into the Temple
column4: and seize the fetishes!

column1: Jammal'an the Prophet^53^All^The Hinterlands^Atal'ai Exile^Atal'ai Exile^^^^The Atal'ai Exile in The Hinterlands wants the Head of Jammal'an.^My Witherbark companions don't take kindly to strangers around their home. Me? I don't have a home anymore. I was exiled from my people
column2: the great Atal'ai tribe of the Swamp of Sorrows. Our spiritual leader
column3: Jammal'an
column4: had what he called a prophecy. He believes the summoning of the god
column5: Hakkar will bring the Atal'ai immortality. But I urged caution. What if the prophecy was nothing more than manipulation? I want revenge for my exile. Bring me Jammal'an's head. Maybe then my people will be free.

column1: The Missing Diplomat^31^Alliance^Stormwind City^Dashel Stonefist^Dashel Stonefist^The Missing Diplomat^^^Defeat Dashel Stonefist in Stormwind.^Yeah
column2: you're obviously not the smartest <class> to come into Stormwind
column3: but you're about to be one of the dumbest to never leave. Have you met me friends?

column1: In Search of The Temple^43^Alliance^Stormwind City^Brohann Caskbelly^Brohann Caskbelly^In Search of The Temple^^^Brohann Caskbelly in Stormwind wants you to search for the Temple of Atal'Hakkar.^There was a time when I was young and full of vigor like you
column2: <class>. But now I'm old and unable to explore the world like I once did. Ah
column3: the things I saw! But there was one mystery that eluded me. For my final quest
column4: the Explorers' League sent me in search of The Temple of Atal'Hakkar. It was rumored to be located in the Swamp of Sorrows. Because of my frail state
column5: I traveled the skies by gryphon in search of it but never found it. Help an old dwarf out? Perhaps you will have better luck on foot.

column1: To The Hinterlands^43^Alliance^Stormwind City^Brohann Caskbelly^Falstad Wildhammer^In Search of The Temple^^^Speak with High Thane Falstad Wildhammer at Aerie Peak in the Hinterlands.^As I mentioned earlier
column2: I attempted to scout the temple on my own from the air. Well
column3: I wasn't exactly alone. I traveled to the renowned gryphon aviary at Aerie Peak in The Hinterlands. There I enlisted the aid of one of their finest pilots. The pilot fell off his mount
column4: down into the swamp... In my old age the poor fellow's name eludes me. The master of the aviary would remember
column5: no doubt. Journey there and seek out Falstad Wildhammer. We need to find out what happened to that pilot.

column1: Gryphon Master Talonaxe^43^Alliance^The Hinterlands^Falstad Wildhammer^Gryphon Master Talonaxe^In Search of The Temple^^^Speak with Gryphon Master Talonaxe inside the Aerie Peak Aviary.^So you're a glorified errand <boy/girl> for some old Explorers' League geezer
column2: eh? Well you listen to me
column3: <class>. I don't know who your old buddy was flying around with down in Azeroth. Do I look like Gryphon Master Talonaxe to you? Do I? If you're so interested in the flight assignments why don't you ask the gryphon master? If I catch you idling around here for much longer
column4: I'm going to put you to some real work. Now get a move on.

column1: Rhapsody Shindigger^43^Alliance^The Hinterlands^Gryphon Master Talonaxe^Rhapsody Shindigger^In Search of The Temple^^^Seek out Rhapsody Shindigger in The Hinterlands.^Rhapsody took quite a liking to the booze. Now don't get me wrong -- all of us dwarves up here at the aviary love a good ale when the time is right. But ol' Shindigger took to the liquor like a gryphon takes to the skies. And a damned shame it was
column2: too. No one could fly like Rhapsody. First sign of trouble was when he came stumbling back from that mission with your buddy
column3: Brohann. All went down hill quickly after that. Had to let him go. Last I heard
column4: he's set up a brew camp to the east of here...

column1: Rhapsody's Kalimdor Kocktail^43^Alliance^The Hinterlands^Rhapsody Shindigger^Rhapsody Shindigger^In Search of The Temple^^Rhapsody's Tale^Rhapsody Shindigger in The Hinterlands wants you to bring him 3 Roc Gizzards
column2: 3 Groddoc Livers and 3 Ironfur Livers.^Hiccup! So that crazy fool Brohann sent ya? My we had quite an adventure...Hiccup! If ya want me to tell ya what happened down in the swamp
column3: I'm gonna need me something stiff to drink. It wasn't a pretty scene
column4: ya see. Hiccup! Tell ya what... bring me what I need to whip up a Kalimdor Kocktail and I'll tell ya all about it. Gonna need some Roc gizzards from Tanaris... and let's see... some Groddoc and Ironfur livers from Feralas... A nice stiff Kalimdor Kocktail... that'll get me talking!

column1: Reclaimers' Business in Desolace^33^Alliance^Ironforge^Roetten Stonehammer^Kreldig Ungor^^^The Karnitol Shipwreck
column2: Reagents for Reclaimers Inc.^Speak to Kreldig Ungor at Nijel's Point in Desolace.^There's work to be done in Desolace
column3: <name>. It's an atrocious place
column4: befouled by centaur and other nasties. But if you're looking for a good week's honest work
column5: then head there
column6: meet with Kreldig Ungor
column7: and tell him I sentcha. You can find him holed up at Nijel's Point--it's a little cozy camp hidden in the mountains of northern Desolace. Just head east if you enter from the Stonetalon Mountains. It's easy to miss
column8: so be on the lookout.

column1: The Karnitol Shipwreck^39^Alliance^Desolace^Kreldig Ungor^Karnitol's Chest^The Karnitol Shipwreck^Reclaimers' Business in Desolace^^Find Karnitol's Chest in Desolace.^My first order of business is for the mage Karnitol--a noble of some sort in Stormwind. Seems his ship was attacked by sea giants while off the coast in the northwest of Desolace. He and his servants tried to bring one of his more valuable chests ashore
column2: but when the sea giants attacked in droves
column3: he chose to abandon it and teleport himself and his servants to safety. He wants us to find the chest and its contents
column4: and return it to him in Stormwind.

column1: The Karnitol Shipwreck^39^Alliance^Desolace^Karnitol's Chest^Kreldig Ungor^The Karnitol Shipwreck^^^Return to Kreldig Ungor at Nijel's Point in Desolace.^You take a few moments to figure out what pried the chest open
column2: and you notice along the sides and top of the chest
column3: long
column4: deep scratches that reveal that something other than a man or giant took interest in it. The marks don't appear as if they were caused by dagger or sword. After going through the chest you find it to be completely empty. Not having another course of action
column5: you close the chest and prepare to leave. Kreldig will be disappointed.

column1: The Karnitol Shipwreck^39^Alliance^Desolace^Kreldig Ungor^Kreldig Ungor^The Karnitol Shipwreck^^^Find Karnitol's Satchel and return it to Kreldig Ungor in Desolace.^Intriguing. Well
column2: we might not be without hope quite yet. Along that same coast
column3: but to the north near Ranazjar Isle
column4: there're night elf ruins at the bottom of the ocean. A tribe of naga
column5: the Slitherblade
column6: make that their home. I think that'd be our best bet. If a scouting party went that far south
column7: then they must've been pretty powerful. If you're gonna find Karnitol's belongings
column8: I'd start with the more powerful naga: the tidehunters or sea witches.

column1: The Karnitol Shipwreck^39^Alliance^Desolace^Kreldig Ungor^Roetten Stonehammer^The Karnitol Shipwreck^^^Bring Karnitol's Satchel to Roetten Stonehammer in Ironforge.^Take Karnitol's things back to Roetten in Ironforge and he'll pay you for a job well done. Haha
column2: if you're not careful
column3: he's gonna be so pleased with ya that he'll ask you to join us full time. Again
column4: great job
column5: <name>. Be careful on your way back
column6: and don't take too much time--Karnitol's not the most of patient of men
column7: but he's very generous nonetheless.

column1: Reagents for Reclaimers Inc.^33^Alliance^Desolace^Kreldig Ungor^Kreldig Ungor^Reagents for Reclaimers Inc.^Reclaimers' Business in Desolace^^Bring 10 Hatefury Claws
column2: and 10 Hatefury Horns to Kreldig Ungor in Desolace.^One of my tasks out here involves picking up some reagents for Leftwitch
column3: a gnome mage in Kharanos . Roetten seems to think it's easy coin in the bank since we're out here already. He doesn't really care that we're short-handed as is. The first few items on his list should be easy enough to get
column4: and it'd be a good chunk of coin for anyone helping me out. I need some horns and claws from the Hatefury satyr to the east of here. Bring 'em back to me and we'll get started on the rest of the list.

column1: Reagents for Reclaimers Inc.^35^Alliance^Desolace^Kreldig Ungor^Kreldig Ungor^Reagents for Reclaimers Inc.^^^Bring 7 vials of Scorpashi Venom and 3 Aged Kodo Hides to Kreldig Ungor in Desolace.^Next on Leftwitch's list is... let's see... hmm. Oh
column2: here it is. Simple enough
column3: but pretty explicit in his directions. He needs venom from the scorpashi
column4: and hide from some kodo. The fine print says both are from specific creatures: the venom's got to come from any of the scorpashi
column5: and the hide's got to come from an aged kodo
column6: not the dying or ancient ones. Mages
column7: I tell ya
column8: some of the stuff they want... it's just weird.

column1: Vahlarriel's Search^33^Alliance^Desolace^Malem Chest^Vahlarriel Demonslayer^Vahlarriel's Search^^^Return the Malem Pendant to Vahlarriel Demonslayer at Nijel's Point in Desolace.^As you continue your search of the wagon you find not only a pendant
column2: but also footprints leading off towards the south. In the distance you can see smoke rising from a large fort. The smoke is from a kept fire
column3: not the burning of buildings
column4: and your instincts tell you that the Malems
column5: if still alive
column6: were taken that direction. You think Vahlarriel at Nijel's Point should not only see the pendant you've found
column7: but also know about the signs of life to the south.

column1: Reagents for Reclaimers Inc.^40^Alliance^Desolace^Kreldig Ungor^Kreldig Ungor^Reagents for Reclaimers Inc.^^^Bring 10 Felhound Brains
column2: 10 Nether Wings
column3: and 10 vials of Doomwarder Blood to Kreldig Ungor in Desolace.^This is the last of the items
column4: and I won't lie
column5: it ain't pretty. I'm also expecting this to take you a little bit longer than the other items. So
column6: enough with the warning
column7: let's get this started. Leftwitch says he needs: ten brains from either mana eaters
column8: mage hunters
column9: or ley hunters. Ten nether wings from a nether maiden
column10: sister or sorceress. And... ten vials of doomwarder blood from a doomwarder captain
column11: or lord. Simple enough
column12: huh? Sheesh... if you wanna pass on this one
column13: I'd understand.

column1: Reagents for Reclaimers Inc.^40^Alliance^Desolace^Kreldig Ungor^Roetten Stonehammer^Reagents for Reclaimers Inc.^^^Bring Leftwitch's Package back to Roetten Stonehammer in Ironforge.^To get paid
column2: you're gonna have to get back to Ironforge and speak to Roetten himself. He'll love getting Leftwitch's package out of the way anyway. Just give him this and it should be enough to get your booty. And don't worry
column3: I'm still going to put in a good word for you when I get back. I shouldn't be in Desolace much longer.

column1: Rhapsody's Tale^43^Alliance^The Hinterlands^Rhapsody Shindigger^Brohann Caskbelly^Rhapsody's Tale^Rhapsody's Kalimdor Kocktail^^Bring the Atal'ai Tablet Fragment to Brohann Caskbelly in Stormwind.^Before the flight
column2: I drank me a whole keg of stout. Hiccup! And what a flight it was. Zipping around with Brohann following me. Didn't see no temple though. Hiccup! Well
column3: didn't see no temple till I got a little too tipsy and fell off my mount. I plunged right into the water and was sucked down. Found myself surrounded by a bunch of creepy trolls. Sure swam out of there fast! Even made off with this troll souvenir. Here
column4: take it to Brohann and let him know his temple is down there
column5: indeed. Hiccup!

column1: The Binding^10^Undead^Warlock^Carendin Halgar^Carendin Halgar^Halgar's Summons^^^Using the Runes of Summoning
column2: summon and subdue a voidwalker
column3: then return the Runes of Summoning to Carendin Halgar in the Magic Quarter of the Undercity.^Surely you have seen the circle of summoning below us? Only there will you be able to draw forth an unbound voidwalker. Using these runes
column4: you will be able to draw it forth
column5: and then you must dominate it through strength of arms and magic. When it is subdued
column6: it will be indentured to you. Come to me then
column7: and I will elucidate the spell of summoning
column8: so that it may serve you to whatever end you wish.

column1: Devourer of Souls^20^Horde^Warlock^Carendin Halgar^Godrick Farsan^Carendin Summons^^Hearts of the Pure^Speak with Godrick Farsan in the Temple of the Damned.^A succubus is a devourer of souls
column2: destroyer of hearts
column3: tempter of men. A creature of profound evil and of singular mind. It cannot be brought into our world without a stimulus. Thus we use its own strength against it. With the hearts of good men
column4: pure men
column5: loving men
column6: the succubus will be unable to resist
column7: and will cross into our world. Then you can dominate it
column8: and make it your own. Speak with my assistant
column9: Godrick Farsan
column10: within the Temple. He will help you find your bait.

column1: Creature of the Void^10^Undead^Warlock^Carendin Halgar^Carendin Halgar^Halgar's Summons^^The Binding^Recover Egalin's Grimoire and bring it to Carendin Halgar in the Temple of the Damned.^It seems the consensus that you are ready to learn to summon a voidwalker. A being created of the chaos that lies beyond
column2: if you summon one but cannot control it
column3: you will be torn asunder. The first voidwalker was summoned by Egalin
column4: and in his grimoire is the process explained. Unfortunately
column5: it was stolen from us by an agent of the Scarlet Crusade who has it secreted away in his base at a tower to the west. Bring it to me
column6: and I will impart the knowledge to you.

column1: The Binding^20^Horde^Warlock^Carendin Halgar^Carendin Halgar^Carendin Summons^^^Using the Pure Hearts
column2: summon and subdue a succubus
column3: then return the Pure Hearts to Carendin Halgar in the Magic Quarter of the Undercity.^Using these hearts
column4: cast a spell at the summoning circle to open a doorway for the succubus to come through. Your powers are greater now
column5: and you will need all of them to defeat the succubus. Beware its charms
column6: <name>
column7: many a strong mind has been bound to its will. When overcome
column8: the succubus will be returned to the void
column9: and I will teach you the spell to summon it forth at your command.

column1: Into The Temple of Atal'Hakkar^50^Alliance^Stormwind City^Brohann Caskbelly^Brohann Caskbelly^Rhapsody's Tale^^^Gather 10 Atal'ai Tablets for Brohann Caskbelly in Stormwind.^According to legend
column2: The Temple of Atal'Hakkar is a holy shrine dedicated to the ancient god
column3: Hakkar the Soulflayer. Maintained by a vicious tribe of trolls named the Atal'ai
column4: the temple is rumored to be impenetrable. Now sunk beneath the Pool of Tears
column5: retrieving artifacts from the temple is even more difficult. But that's what I need you to do
column6: <name>. Aid me by gathering the intact Atal'ai Tablets. Bring them to me and I will return to the Explorers' Guild a hero. Together we will share the glory.

column1: Hearts of the Pure^20^Horde^Warlock^Godrick Farsan^Carendin Halgar^Carendin Summons^^^Bring the hearts of Dalin Forgewright and Comar Villard to Carendin Halgar in the Temple of the Damned.^Men of honor and goodness? Does such a man exist? It took much research
column2: but through bits of overheard stories
column3: I managed to find two men that should do. The first is Dalin Forgewright
column4: who has dedicated himself to the care of the Lordaeron refugees
column5: whom are refused by their kin at the Greymane Wall. The other is Comar Villard
column6: a man who remains faithful to his lost love
column7: wandering the Wetlands for a sign of his wife. Deliver their hearts to Carendin. But first
column8: let me show you your quarry.

column1: Vital Supplies^45^Alliance^Stormwind City^High Sorcerer Andromath^Watchmaster Sorigal^Vital Supplies^^^Speak with Watchmaster Sorigal at Darkshire in Duskwood.^Our mages are conducting research at Nethergarde Keep in the Blasted Lands
column2: research vital to our understanding of the Dark Portals. They require nearly constant supplies
column3: but our supply line to Nethergarde is tenuous. You must help ensure the supplies make it to Nethergard. Report to Watchmaster Sorigal in Darkshire
column4: and do as he asks. This task will take you into hostile lands
column5: <name>. Prepare yourself.

column1: Halgar's Summons^10^Undead^Warlock^Ageron Kargal^Carendin Halgar^Halgar's Summons^^^Speak with Carendin Halgar in the Undercity.^Ah
column2: <name>! I just received word from Carendin Halgar that he would like to see you for further training. You should be proud of yourself
column3: <name>. It's not every day that Master Halgar personally sees fit to instruct a young warlock. You'll be able to find him in the Magic Quarter of the Undercity
column4: near the Temple of the Damned.

column1: The Corrupter^33^Horde^Desolace^Flayed Demon Skin (old2)^Maurin Bonesplitter^The Corrupter^^^Bring the Flayed Demon Skin to Maurin Bonesplitter in Desolace.^The torn skin smells rotten
column2: and is remarkably pliable for something that appears to be dry and fragile. As you unroll it
column3: you can clearly see the red markings of some kind of language on one side. At the bottom of the skin is a very clear symbol that you guess is a signature of some kind. Perhaps it is something Maurin could tell you more about?

column1: The Corrupter^33^Horde^Desolace^Maurin Bonesplitter^Maurin Bonesplitter^The Corrupter^^^Bring a Shadowstalker Scalp to Maurin Bonesplitter in Desolace.^I believe I can find this demon lord given the proper reagents. If he is indeed as powerful as I suspect
column2: I will need items gathered from deadly creatures. But you act in the Warchief's name
column3: so I am sure you will accept my task. First
column4: I will have to break any wards he has against scrying. For this
column5: I will need the scalp from a satyr--but not any satyr. The scalp must come from a Hatefury shadowstalker. Search for them among the ancient ruins in the northeast of Desolace.

column1: The Corrupter^35^Horde^Desolace^Maurin Bonesplitter^Maurin Bonesplitter^The Corrupter^^The Corrupter^Bring an Oracle Crystal to Maurin Bonesplitter in Desolace.^An oracle crystal would do nicely. They are crafted by the naga for their oracles to use. Northwest of here
column2: along the coast
column3: is a vast coral reef that the naga have taken as their home when this close to the shore. You can find their oracles there. The Slitherblade are deadly and will not react kindly to your intrusions
column4: so be careful and make haste. When you return
column5: we shall see about finding this demon lord Azrethoc.

column1: Ziz Fizziks^21^All^The Barrens^Sputtervalve^Ziz Fizziks^Ziz Fizziks^^^Speak with Ziz Fizziks in Windshear Crag in Stonetalon Mountains.^The Venture Company stole many of the best goblin minds
column2: but from time to time
column3: we get the opportunity to steal some back. A while ago
column4: the Venture Company outfit in the Stonetalon Mountains hired Gerenzo Wrenchwhistle--a gnome! Their other engineer
column5: Ziz Fizziks
column6: was so taken aback by this
column7: he pleaded with me to find him new employment with the Tinkers' Union. I set him on a few tasks
column8: but he might need help. Maybe you could look in on him for me? He's stationed at the western edge of Windshear Crag.

column1: The Corrupter^33^Horde^Desolace^Maurin Bonesplitter^Takata Steelblade^^The Corrupter^The Corrupter^Speak to Takata Steelblade in Desolace.^This creature is far more dangerous than I had anticipated. No doubt Takata questions my abilities to take on such a creature
column2: and it would insult his honor if he were not informed about what just happened. Speak to the swordsman
column3: tell him you are willing to slay the demon if he would allow it
column4: but do not press too hard. It is better if he thinks it his own idea.

column1: Deviate Hides^17^All^Wailing Caverns^Nalpak^Nalpak^^^^Nalpak in the Wailing Caverns wants 20 Deviate Hides.^As Naralex descended deeper into his nightmare
column2: a strange breed of beasts arose from beneath the Barrens into the Wailing Caverns. These deviate creatures have strange
column3: otherworldly properties. While evil in nature
column4: it is my opinion that some good can come from their existence here in Kalimdor. I believe their hides will be of particular use in the ways of leatherworking. If you feel up to the task
column5: venture into the caves below and retrieve some deviate hides.

column1: Deviate Eradication^21^All^Wailing Caverns^Ebru^Ebru^^^^Ebru in the Wailing Caverns wants you to kill 7 Deviate Ravagers
column2: 7 Deviate Vipers
column3: 7 Deviate Shamblers and 7 Deviate Dreadfangs.^Naralex had a noble goal. Our great leader aspired to enter the Emerald Dream and help regrow these harsh lands back into the lush forest it once was. But something went terribly wrong. Naralex's dream turned into a nightmare and corrupt creatures began to inhabit the caverns. While some Disciples of Naralex seek to awake our master
column4: my concern is with ridding these caves of the evil beasts. Brave the caverns
column5: <name>
column6: and eradicate the deviate spawn.

column1: The Corrupter^40^Horde^Desolace^Takata Steelblade^Takata Steelblade^^The Corrupter^^Slay Lord Azrethoc and Jugkar Grim'rod and return to Takata Steelblade in Desolace.^Although I have no knowledge of this Lord Azrethoc
column2: I agree with Maurin
column3: he must be stopped; especially if he is attempting to gain influence over the Burning Blade to further his goals. You have already shown you wish to aid the Warchief
column4: and I would trust you to gather a party to slay the demon lord and his warlock servant. When you are ready
column5: head directly south
column6: and return to me when the threat has been ended.

column1: Hamuul Runetotem^16^Horde^Wailing Caverns^Tonga Runetotem^Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem^Hamuul Runetotem^Altered Beings^^Speak with Hamuul Runetotem.^The shells you brought me have a taint
column2: one I have never before seen. I am certain the water of the Oases is the cause
column3: and I can sense the confusion they cause this land. It is as if the land dreams and cannot awake. The Wailing Caverns must be the source of the taint. But before you go there
column4: speak with Hamuul Runetotem
column5: the elder druid. I sent word to him of the happenings in the Barrens. He is wise
column6: and can offer you counsel. You will find him in Thunder Bluff
column7: on the Elder Rise.

column1: Nara Wildmane^16^Horde^Wailing Caverns^Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem^Nara Wildmane^Hamuul Runetotem^^^Speak with Nara Wildmane.^I entered the land of dreams
column2: and dreamed of a cult of druids who dwell in the Wailing Caverns. I saw that their goals were once noble
column3: but they have lost their way. They are now servants of the taint seeping through the Barrens. I am old and my strength fails. I could not long dwell in that dreaming place and know little more of the tainted druids. But Nara is young and her spirit is fierce. She remained in the dreaming when I fled. Speak with Nara. She is in the tent
column4: over yonder.

column1: Smart Drinks^18^All^Wailing Caverns^Mebok Mizzyrix^Mebok Mizzyrix^^Raptor Horns^^Bring 6 portions of Wailing Essence to Mebok Mizzyrix in Ratchet.^Ok
column2: so the raptor horns didn't work so well. But that's all right -- no one got rich on their first try! And besides
column3: I think I found something that'll work even better in my smart drinks! There is a substance called Wailing Essence
column4: and I think it is the cause of the strange plants and animals in the Barrens. Get me some and I'll try it in my drink! I heard the essence gathers in ectoplasmic creatures in the Wailing Caverns to the west. Hunt those creatures and gather the essence.

column1: Wharfmaster Dizzywig^11^Horde^The Barrens^Apothecary Helbrim^Wharfmaster Dizzywig^^^^Bring the Secure Crate to Wharfmaster Dizzywig in Ratchet.^I have need to send a crate of potions
column2: reagents and other items to my associates in the Old World. Little time I have to actually see them to the dock at Ratchet
column3: and the last caravan has already left. If you could
column4: please take this to Wharfmaster Dizzywig. He will ensure that it is placed on the next boat to Blackwater Cove.

column1: Path of Defense^10^Horde^Warrior^Uzzek^Uzzek^Veteran Uzzek^^^Bring 5 Singed Scales to Uzzek at Far Watch Post in the Barrens.^As a warrior
column2: one of our most crucial tasks is... protection. We are the shield of the Horde
column3: and we keep our weaker brethren safe. If you are to join in our ranks
column4: then you must prove your mettle to me. Go to Thunder Ridge in Durotar
column5: where live the lightning hides and thunder lizards. Hunt the beasts! Show me you are tougher than they! Brave their assaults and bring me a stack of their singed scales as proof. Do this
column6: and then I will teach you.

column1: Vile Familiars^1^Orc
column2: Troll^Warlock^Ruzan^Zureetha Fargaze^Vile Familiars^^Burning Blade Medallion^Speak with Zureetha Fargaze.^Zureetha has been sending novices like yourself to help cull the numbers of the creatures in the cave near where you fought the vile familiars. I think it would be good for you to gain experience by assisting her. Be sure to tell her that you assisted with the imp problem
column3: she'll probably have a reward for you.

column1: Creature of the Void^10^Orc^Warlock^Gan'rul Bloodeye^Gan'rul Bloodeye^Gan'rul's Summons^^The Binding^Retrieve the Tablet of Verga for Gan'rul Bloodeye in Orgrimmar.^So few warlocks remain... We risk much
column2: but the risks are warranted. You must quickly reach maturity in your ability if you are to be of use to the Horde and to the Warchief. It is time that you learned a new summoning spell. First
column3: you must recover the Tablet of Verga
column4: which was stolen by warlocks of the Burning Blade and is now kept at their lair in Skull Rock to the east of the city. With the tablet
column5: I will show you the runes necessary to summoning a voidwalker.

column1: Thun'grim Firegaze^10^Horde^Warrior^Uzzek^Thun'grim Firegaze^Veteran Uzzek^^^Speak with Thun'grim Firegaze in the Barrens.^It is vital that a warrior's weapon is one of quality. And if there is an orc who can craft quality weapons
column2: then that orc is Thun'grim Firegaze. He is a hermit who dwells atop the hills east of the Crossroads. If you seek a weapon
column3: warrior
column4: then you should seek Thun'grim. To find him
column5: first travel to the Crossroads to the west
column6: then strike east into the hills. His camp is high on a hilltop.

column1: Forged Steel^10^Horde^Warrior^Thun'grim Firegaze^Thun'grim Firegaze^Veteran Uzzek^^^Bring the Forged Steel Bars to Thun'grim Firegaze in the Barrens.^I will give you a weapon
column2: <name>
column3: but first you must aid me. The Razormanes to the northwest came into my camp a few nights past. They would not meet me in combat
column4: but they know my eyes are bad--a few distracted me with snorts while others stole from me! The cowards! They took an iron chest
column5: and within it were some forged steel bars. If you can recover them then I will give you the weapon you seek. Search for the iron box within the quilboar camps
column6: and return with the forged steel bars.

column1: The Binding^10^Orc^Warlock^Gan'rul Bloodeye^Gan'rul Bloodeye^Gan'rul's Summons^^^Using the Glyphs of Summoning
column2: summon and subdue a voidwalker
column3: then return the Glyphs of Summoning to Gan'rul Bloodeye in Orgrimmar.^Now
column4: observe the Tablet of Verga
column5: for it contains the glyphs you will need for the summoning. Take them to the circle in Neeru Fireblade's tent on the other side of the cavern. There you will be able to call for the voidwalker. You must defeat it using whatever physical and magical means you have at your disposal. When this is completed
column6: return to me with the glyphs of summoning and I will demonstrate how you may bind the creature to your will.

column1: Veteran Uzzek^10^Horde^Warrior^Krang Stonehoof^Uzzek^Veteran Uzzek^^Path of Defense^Speak with Uzzek at Far Watch Post in the Barrens.^The Horde honors its warriors because their strength is unquestioned. But the truly great warriors are great students as well. Seek out Uzzek. He is a veteran of many battles and now instructs young warriors in the ways of combat. You will find him south of Far Watch Post
column2: the orc garrison on the border of the Barrens and Durotar.

column1: Gan'rul's Summons^10^Orc^Warlock^Ophek^Gan'rul Bloodeye^Gan'rul's Summons^^^Speak with Gan'rul Bloodeye in Orgrimmar.^You there. <name>
column2: right? I hope your schedule isn't busy
column3: because Gan'rul wants to see you right away. You'll find him with the senior warlocks in the Cleft of Shadow. Based on my past dealings with Gan'rul
column4: your summons is either a very good thing or a very bad thing.

column1: Devourer of Souls^20^Horde^Warlock^Gan'rul Bloodeye^Cazul^Devourer of Souls^^Hearts of the Pure^Speak with Cazul in the Cleft of Shadow.^The time has come for you to learn more of the summoning magics. You will learn to summon a succubus
column2: a creature of incredible mental powers. It can lull those of weak minds into its servitude--but have no fear! I feel certain that you will be equal to the challenge. A succubus can only be summoned when baited with an item that represents great devotion and love. I leave it to you to find such an object. A suggestion? Speak with Cazul... There seems to be little the ancient warlock does not know.

column1: Blind Cazul^20^Horde^Warlock^Cazul^Zankaja^Devourer of Souls^^^Speak with Zankaja in Orgrimmar.^Hmm... But
column2: of course
column3: that is not why you have come to speak with me. If Gan'rul has sent you to me
column4: it must be that you are to summon a succubus
column5: and need an object to use for enticement. Hmm... If you trust a blind man to lead you
column6: <name>
column7: then listen. In the bluffs of Orgrimmar
column8: west of the wind rider tower
column9: lives Zankaja. She waits for the return of her mate. Go to her.

column1: News of Dogran^20^Horde^Warlock^Zankaja^Gazrog^Devourer of Souls^^^Speak with Gazrog at the Crossroads.^My mate
column2: Dogran
column3: was recently sent to the Crossroads for duty. It was a promotion
column4: and he was very proud. I was sad
column5: of course
column6: but I didn't let him know that. And worried
column7: too. The Barrens is a more dangerous place than Orgrimmar
column8: and I feared the worst. Now it's been a week after he should have returned
column9: and I have received no word from him... Perhaps you could go to the Crossroads and see if they have any news? He worked with Gazrog
column10: who should still be stationed there.

column1: News of Dogran^20^Horde^Warlock^Gazrog^Ken'zigla^Devourer of Souls^^^Speak with Ken'zigla at the Malaka'jin.^He was stationed at Camp Taurajo
column2: where we've been trying to weed out the quilboar. He led a few grunts to one of their camps
column3: where he was hurt bad. The others made it back and tried to rescue him. He was in bad shape
column4: his wounds festered
column5: so they were afraid to move him without patching him up first. They sent a message here
column6: requesting a healing draught from the trolls at the Malaka'jin at the base of the Stonetalon Mountains. We sent someone to get it
column7: but they haven't returned yet.

column1: Ken'zigla's Draught^20^Horde^Warlock^Ken'zigla^Grunt Logmar^Devourer of Souls^^^Bring Ken'zigla's Draught to Grunt Logmar at Camp Taurajo.^I figured there might be another coming to get the draught
column2: so I prepared it anyways. Here you go
column3: <name>. Mind you
column4: you should only give half of it to him! That will give him enough strength to move without bleeding himself dry. Wait a night
column5: then give him the other half. Anyways
column6: you'll want to bring this to Logmar at Camp Taurajo. From what the first one told me
column7: he should have an idea where this Dogran is.

column1: Love's Gift^20^Horde^Warlock^Grunt Dogran^Gan'rul Bloodeye^Devourer of Souls^^^Bring the Dirt-caked Pendant to Gan'rul Bloodeye in Orgrimmar.^Zankaja is young and beautiful. To be chained to an invalid... I will not allow her to suffer that injustice. Leave me
column2: <name>. And thank you. I may end my life in glorious battle
column3: instead of a lifeless husk. And please
column4: I would ask you not to tell my mate of this... I do not want guilt on her conscience.

column1: The Binding^20^Horde^Warlock^Gan'rul Bloodeye^Gan'rul Bloodeye^Devourer of Souls^^^Using Dogran's Pendant
column2: summon and subdue a succubus
column3: then return Dogran's Pendant to Gan'rul Bloodeye in Orgrimmar.^Take this to the summoning circle in Neeru's tent
column4: <name>. Summon forth a foul succubus
column5: then show it your mastery. I believe in the strength of your magic. As always
column6: though
column7: be wary
column8: for pride and overconfidence has overcome many a promising warlock. When you have defeated it
column9: return the pendant to me so that I might deliver the news to Zankaja.

column1: Dogran's Captivity^20^Horde^Warlock^Grunt Logmar^Grunt Dogran^Devourer of Souls^^^Bring Ken'zigla's Draught to Dogran in the Barrens.^You've made it this far
column2: so if you want to see this through to the end
column3: I won't stop you. I can't spare you any additional manpower though
column4: you'll be on your own. Dogran is being held in a quilboar camp to the north of here. Look for a group of two huts. He'll be heavily guarded--that is
column5: if they haven't killed him yet
column6: or he hasn't succumbed to his wounds. Good luck.

column1: Call of Earth^4^Orc
column2: Troll^Shaman^Canaga Earthcaller^Canaga Earthcaller^^^Call of Earth^Bring 2 Felstalker Hooves to Canaga Earthcaller in the Valley of Trials.^The time is now
column3: young <class>. You've grown strong and your spirit endures like the earth. Following the shaman's path shows you have wisdom before even proving yourself. The element of earth will guide your destiny
column4: becoming part of you if you are ready. But you must stand before the earth itself. If you are ready
column5: then you will see things only shaman know of. Seek out the Felstalkers to the north
column6: and take from them two of their hooves. Return to me then
column7: and we shall speak more of your future.

column1: Call of Earth^4^Orc
column2: Troll^Shaman^Canaga Earthcaller^Minor Manifestation of Earth^^^Call of Earth^Find Spirit Rock and drink the Earth Sapta.^A sapta is a drink created to bind our spirits to the elements. Fused with magic
column3: the potion will allow the strong willed to see the elements as no one else can. Your spirit will be connected to the element the sapta was created for
column4: and only a select few shaman know the recipe. The sapta is always drunk in a holy place
column5: and never anywhere else--remember that. Seek out Spirit Rock southwest of here--it is found at the end of the Hidden Path. Drink your sapta there
column6: and... well
column7: you shall see.

column1: Call of Earth^4^Orc
column2: Troll^Shaman^Minor Manifestation of Earth^Canaga Earthcaller^^Call of Earth^^Bring the Rough Quartz to Canaga Earthcaller in the Valley of Trials.^Take this rough quartz from me and bring it to Canaga Earthcaller as proof of our meeting. He will craft a totem for you
column3: and this pebble will be the heart of it. As small as it may seem
column4: you will come to find that size does not matter
column5: and that even the smallest of things can outlast many others. Be patient
column6: <name>. Remain strong. And seek wisdom. This is what earth asks of you. In the end
column7: you shall become one with the earth--respect it as it shall respect you.

column1: Call of Earth^4^Tauren^Shaman^Seer Ravenfeather^Seer Ravenfeather^^^Call of Earth
column2: Call of Earth^Bring 2 applications of Ritual Salve to Seer Ravenfeather in Camp Narache.^The time has come
column3: young <class>. Your body ages and grows strong
column4: and your spirit endures like the earth. I see it within you-you have wisdom already. The earth guides our people
column5: and it speaks to us
column6: as it will to you in time. But you must be tested. If you are ready
column7: then you shall see things only our kind know of. Seek out the Bristleback shamans in their ravine to the east
column8: and take from them a salve they use in their rituals. Return to me only when you have enough for your own potion.

column1: Call of Earth^4^Tauren^Shaman^Seer Ravenfeather^Minor Manifestation of Earth^^Call of Earth^Call of Earth^Find Kodo Rock and drink the Earth Sapta.^A sapta is a drink created to bind our spirits to the elements. Fused with magic
column2: the potion will allow the open minded to see the elements as no one has seen them before. Your spirit will forever be tied to the element the sapta was created for
column3: and only a select few of our kind know the secrets of its creation. The sapta is always imbibed in a holy place
column4: and never anywhere else. Seek out the shaman shrine to the east of here and drink of the sapta.

column1: Call of Earth^4^Tauren^Shaman^Minor Manifestation of Earth^Seer Ravenfeather^^Call of Earth^^Bring the Rough Quartz to Seer Ravenfeather in Camp Narache.^Take this rough quartz from me and bring it to Seer Ravenfeather as proof of our meeting. She will craft a totem for you
column2: and this pebble will be the heart of it. As small as it may seem
column3: you will come to find that size does not matter
column4: and that even the smallest of things can outlast mountains. Be patient
column5: <name>. Remain strong. And seek wisdom. This is what earth asks of you. In the end
column6: you shall become one with the earth--respect it as it shall respect you.

column1: Call of Fire^10^Horde^Shaman^Searn Firewarder^Kranal Fiss^Call of Fire^^^Find Kranal Fiss in the Barrens.^Fire be witcha
column2: mon. I see you be strong in da ways of earth already
column3: an' me tinkin' you be ready to talk to Kranal. Kranal live north of da Crossroads in da Barrens. He be strong in da ways of da elements and can teach ya da ways of fire... if you tink you be ready. He be easy ta find
column4: just don' go too far--ya go too far an' ya find yerself in da elves' lands.

column1: Call of Fire^10^Horde^Shaman^Beram Skychaser^Kranal Fiss^Call of Fire^^^Find Kranal Fiss in the Barrens.^Long has it been since you were last tested
column2: <name>. You have shown patience thus far in your studies
column3: but the time has come for you to learn more. The time has come for you to learn about destruction... and chaos. The element of fire is yours for the understanding
column4: if you're prepared to pay for it. Seek out Kranal Fiss in the Barrens. He lives in a small dwelling north of the Crossroads
column5: but be mindful
column6: if you've reached the night elf lands
column7: you've gone too far.

column1: Call of Fire^10^Horde^Shaman^Kranal Fiss^Telf Joolam^Call of Fire^^^Bring the Torch of the Dormant Flame to Telf Joolam in Durotar.^You are powerful enough to wield the totem of fire
column2: but that does not mean you are ready. Along the Southfury River in Durotar
column3: before the Great Sea
column4: lies a hidden trail to one of the highest peaks in the land. Find your way to the top and you shall find one of our holy shrines watched over by Telf Joolam--the Shrine of the Dormant Flame. Take this torch to him--it marks that you attempt to tame fire. Return it to me aflame by the brazier at the shrine and I will see you are given the totem of fire.

column1: Call of Fire^10^Horde^Shaman^Telf Joolam^Telf Joolam^Call of Fire^^^Bring 1 Fire Tar and 1 Reagent Pouch to Telf Joolam in Durotar.^But you did not come here for a history lesson
column2: did you? You came for the Eternal Flame and fire totem. The first step is to create a sapta and bind you to the flame. I can create the fire sapta for you if you bring me two items. The first is fire tar
column3: a simple item usually carried by Razormane spellcasters in eastern Barrens. The second item will be more dangerous: a reagent pouch from one of the cultists of the Burning Blade. You can find them in a cave above the ravines northeast of Razor Hill.

column1: Call of Fire^10^Horde^Shaman^Telf Joolam^Brazier of the Dormant Flame^Call of Fire^^^Defeat the Minor Manifestation of Fire
column2: and place the Glowing Ember in the brazier atop the Shrine of Eternal Flame.^The fire sapta is finished. The time has come for you to face the flame. Use the sapta at the shrine and head to the top of the mountain to face the manifestation there. He will not attack until you are ready
column3: but he will realize you are able to see him. Strike him down swiftly
column4: <name>
column5: for he shall only grow in power the longer you take to slay him. Once he is defeated
column6: place his glowing embers within the brazier and light the torch.

column1: Call of Fire^10^Horde^Shaman^Brazier of the Dormant Flame^Kranal Fiss^Call of Fire^^^Bring the Torch of Eternal Flame to Kranal Fiss in the Barrens.^Torch firmly in hand
column2: you turn away from the brazier and look out over Durotar. You feel an excitement tugging at your spirit as the wind picks up and forces the flame to dance violently. You start off down the path back to the Barrens in search of Kranal Fiss.

column1: Call of Water^20^Horde^Shaman^Searn Firewarder^Islen Waterseer^Call of Water^^^Find Islen Waterseer in the Barrens.^Water be in ya future
column2: mon. I see you be strong in da ways of fire already
column3: an' me tinkin' you be ready to talk to Islen. Islen live along the coast of da Barrens. If ya head south along the Southfury River
column4: ya canna miss her--look fer da big shark! She be strong in da ways of da elements and can teach ya da ways of water... if you tink you be ready. She be easy ta find
column5: just don' go too far south--she be jus' beyond Ratchet.

column1: Call of Water^20^Horde^Shaman^Xanis Flameweaver^Islen Waterseer^Call of Water^^^Find Islen Waterseer in the Barrens.^Long has it been since you were last tested
column2: <name>. You have shown patience thus far in your studies
column3: but the time has come for you to learn more. The time has come for you to learn about the purity of water. Seek out Islen Waterseer in the Barrens. She is along the eastern coast
column4: south of the Southfury River and Ratchet. You will find her there at her fishing hut. Good luck to you
column5: <name>.

column1: Call of Water^20^Horde^Shaman^Islen Waterseer^Brine^Call of Water^^^Find Brine at Blackthorn Ridge in Southern Barrens.^If there is one lesson you must learn of water
column2: it is this: water means rebirth. Its power flows
column3: erodes
column4: and makes clean all manner of things. You will find its ability to heal and replenish incomparable
column5: but only when it is pure. When you understand that water
column6: when polluted
column7: can devastate all that it touches
column8: you will appreciate how vital a resource it is. If you wish the water sapta
column9: find Brine deep in Southern Barrens. Her home is continually molested by the quilboar there.

column1: Call of Air^30^Horde^Shaman^Searn Firewarder^Prate Cloudseer^^^^Find Prate Cloudseer in Thousand Needles.^You be makin' headway now
column2: mon. Your be ready to prove yerself worthy of the air totem
column3: but first
column4: ya must fin' Prate Cloudseer in Thousand Needles. She be willin' ta tell ya how to get yer air totem if ya treat her wit enough respect. Head south through the Barrens
column5: and after ya reach Thousand Needles
column6: head east. You'll find her hiddin' in a hole wit' her boyfriend--haha
column7: don' tell her I be dissin' her none--she not take it too kindly.

column1: Call of Air^30^Horde^Shaman^Xanis Flameweaver^Prate Cloudseer^^^^Find Prate Cloudseer in Thousand Needles.^The winds of Kalimdor rush to meet you and you shall be counted among some of our most powerful <brothers/sisters>. I am proud to see you have come this far and have such a promising future. The element of air is a difficult one to control
column2: but I have faith that your skills will overcome any obstacles that are placed in front of you. Head to the very south of the Barrens
column3: and enter Thousand Needles. It is there
column4: far to the east
column5: that you will find Prate Cloudseer. She will teach you more.

column1: Call of Water^20^Horde^Shaman^Brine^Brine^Call of Water^^^Fill the Empty Blue Waterskin at the Ruins of Stardust in Ashenvale and return to Brine in the Barrens.^Take this waterskin and head deep into the lush forest the night elves call Ashenvale. It is to the far north of the Barrens. Once you've entered the forest
column2: travel west. Along the mountains that separate Stonetalon and Ashenvale
column3: and beyond Lake Mystral
column4: you will find a holy place: the Ruins of Stardust. At the center of the lake you will find a small fountain. Bring me a sample of the fountain's water. It will be the final component you'll need before I send you back to Islen.

column1: Call of Water^20^Horde^Shaman^Brine^Brine^Call of Water^^^Fill the Empty Brown Waterskin at the watering hole below Brine's hut and return it to her in the Barrens.^To find understanding and gain the sapta from me
column2: you must seek out only the purest forms of water. As you fetch the samples for me
column3: take note of your surroundings. Be aware of the creatures that rely on the water
column4: that protect it. See how it affects forests and deserts. Witness how the very substance that sustains life will force creatures to take lives. We shall start with a simple task: down below my hut there is a pond of the precious liquid. Fill this skin with it and return to me.

column1: Call of Water^20^Horde^Shaman^Brine^Brine^Call of Water^^^Fill the Empty Red Waterskin at the well in Tarren Mill and return to Brine in the Barrens.^Long ago I followed some companions into the Hillsbrad Foothills. We defended ourselves from some tenacious humans who make their home there and we found ourselves in a small town the Forsaken had taken over: Tarren Mill. It was there I found a most peculiar thing: in the center of town was a small well of fresh spring water. I'm not sure the plagued citizens of the town even realize its value--it's a small holy vestige in an unhallowed sea. Bring me a sample of that water in this waterskin.
Tooga's Quest^50^All^Tanaris^Tooga^Torta^^^^Show Tooga the way back to his wife
column2: Torta.^I am so lost! My wife
column3: Torta
column4: sent me out to fetch dinner and I must have taken a wrong turn somewhere. Would you be so kind as to lead me back to Torta? She's waiting for me just south of Steamwheedle Port.

column1: Supplying the Front^12^Alliance^Blacksmithing^Tormus Deepforge^Thorvald Deepforge^^^^Bring 6 Copper Axes and 6 Copper Chain Belts to Thorvald in the southern guard tower of Loch Modan.^The mountaineers of Loch Modan are fighting troggs
column2: and having a busy time of it! They need constant supplies of new armor and weapons if we're ever to get a handle on those troggs. That's why my colleague Thorvald is there
column3: trying to keep the mountaineers in good gear. So if you were to make some copper axes and copper chain belts and bring them to Thorvald
column4: he would be obliged. He might even share his knowledge with you. Thorvald is in Loch Modan's southern guard tower.

column1: Gaffer Jacks^12^Alliance^Fishing^Wizbang Cranktoggle^Wizbang Cranktoggle^Gaffer Jacks^^^Bring 8 Gaffer Jacks to Wizbang Cranktoggle in Auberdine.^I came to Auberdine because of the quiet. I want to invent my inventions where it's quiet
column2: because after a night of drinking I don't like all the noise of Ironforge! So I took a ship to Auberdine and had a little too much to drink on the way. I dropped my box of gaffer jacks overboard! I need my gaffer jacks! I don't know exactly where I dropped them
column3: but if you fish for them in the ocean you might get lucky...

column1: Electropellers^12^Alliance^Fishing^Wizbang Cranktoggle^Wizbang Cranktoggle^Gaffer Jacks^^^Bring 12 Electropellers to Wizbang Cranktoggle in Auberdine.^We know you're lucky
column2: but... just how lucky are you
column3: <name>? One night I was wandering the roads of Darkshore. I was looking for a good river or lake to try my new self-propelled
column4: exploding duck decoy and I think I was a little tipsy... because I passed out and awoke hours later in Auberdine. My hair was singed and my bag of electropellers was gone! I must have dropped them in the water! I need those electropellers! Maybe you can fish them out of some lake or stream in Darkshore...

column1: Elixirs for the Bladeleafs^8^Alliance^Alchemy^Syral Bladeleaf^Syral Bladeleaf^^^^Bring 6 Elixirs of Lion's Strength and 2 Elixirs of Minor Defense to Syral Bladeleaf in Dolanaar.^Our herb and alchemy shop is booming
column2: but my husband spends so much time mixing potions that we never have time for each other. Can you help us? If you can bring me a supply of pre-made elixirs
column3: then I would be happy to trade with you. I have some rare herbs that you might find useful.

column1: Moonglow Vest^18^Alliance^Leatherworking^Lotherias^Lotherias^^^^Bring 1 Embossed Leather Gloves
column2: 5 Embossed Leather Boots and 5 Embossed Leather Cloaks to Lotherias in Darnassus.^We in Darnassus
column3: especially we craftsman
column4: are quite busy. Young adventurers are eager to test themselves in the wilderness
column5: and are in constant need of supplies. If you can help me fill my orders of leather goods
column6: then perhaps I can teach you an advanced leatherworking technique.

column1: Gearing Redridge^16^Alliance^Blacksmithing^Tormus Deepforge^Verner Osgood^^^^Tormus Deepforge wants you to bring 4 Runed Copper Belts and 4 Heavy Copper Mauls to Verner Osgood in Redridge.^We dwarves aren't the only ones fighting. Our human allies have their hands full too! Redridge is under periodic attack from blackrock orcs
column2: and their supply of equipment is always low. If you were to help them out
column3: I'm sure their resident blacksmith
column4: Verner Osgood
column5: would teach you a trick or two.

column1: A Warrior's Training^10^Alliance^Warrior^Lyria Du Lac^Harry Burlguard^A Warrior's Training^^Bartleby the Drunk^Speak with Harry Burlguard in Stormwind.^You've shown yourself to be a competent warrior
column2: <name>. But you're still young and have a lot to learn. Speak with Harry Burlguard--he's usually in the Pig and Whistle tavern
column3: in the Old Town of Stormwind. Harry is an old veteran and a good teacher. He can show you a few moves that'll keep you breathing longer.

column1: Bartleby the Drunk^10^Alliance^Warrior^Harry Burlguard^Bartleby^A Warrior's Training^^^Speak with Bartleby.^Yeah
column2: I can teach you. But first I wanna see what moves you have already. See that drunk over there at the end of the bar? Bartleby? I want you to get his mug. Hah
column3: and if you know Bartleby then you know he won't just give it to you.

column1: Beat Bartleby^10^Alliance^Warrior^Bartleby^Bartleby^A Warrior's Training^^^Beat Bartleby
column2: then talk to him.^You want what?? You're crazy! The only way you'll get this mug is if you pry it from my cold
column3: dead fingers...

column1: The Tome of Divinity^12^Human^Paladin^Tome of Divinity^Duthorian Rall^The Tome of Divinity^^The Tome of Divinity^Speak to Duthorian Rall in Stormwind.^In all things
column2: a paladin must reflect the Light which supplements our strength. To strive to be divine for one of our kind does not mean we strive for godhood--we strive to be good in all actions. Although called upon to smite evil in these harsh times
column3: you must always remember that it's aiding others that will truly set you apart from the citizens of Azeroth. Compassion
column4: patience
column5: bravery--these things mean as much to a paladin as strength in battle. Know this well
column6: and never forget it.

column1: The Tome of Divinity^12^Human^Paladin^Duthorian Rall^Stephanie Turner^The Tome of Divinity^^^Search the Trade District of Stormwind for Stephanie Turner.^Your task then
column2: <name>
column3: is to find someone here in Stormwind that is in need of aid. Someone who is pure of heart and motive. Perhaps someone helping others. Perhaps someone in need of a guide. Regardless
column4: the person must have noble intent and be relying on your kindness. Do this
column5: and return to me when you are finished. Then
column6: we shall discuss more of your path and what it means to be a paladin of the Light.

column1: The Tome of Divinity^12^Human^Paladin^Stephanie Turner^Stephanie Turner^The Tome of Divinity^^^Bring 10 Linen Cloth to Stephanie Turner in Stormwind.^Bless their hearts
column2: most of them have no families because of the Scourge attacks in the last decade. My husband John collects the materials for me to make the shirts and pants for the children
column3: but I haven't even had time to do that. I've been too focused on keeping food on their plates
column4: and a roof over their heads. What's that? You'd be willing to help? Oh
column5: thank the Light
column6: and thank you
column7: <name>. If you could bring me some linen cloth so I can sew clothes for the kids
column8: that would help me out so much.

column1: The Tome of Divinity^12^Dwarf^Paladin^Tome of Divinity^Tiza Battleforge^The Tome of Divinity^^The Tome of Divinity^Speak to Tiza Battleforge in Ironforge.^In all things
column2: a paladin must reflect the Light which supplements our strength. To strive to be divine for one of our kind does not mean we strive for godhood--we strive to be good in all actions. Although called upon to smite evil in these harsh times
column3: you must always remember that it's aiding others that will truly set you apart from the citizens of Azeroth. Compassion
column4: patience
column5: bravery--these things mean as much to a paladin as strength in battle. Know this well
column6: and never forget it.

column1: The Tome of Divinity^12^Dwarf^Paladin^Tiza Battleforge^John Turner^The Tome of Divinity^^^Search the outer ring of Ironforge for John Turner.^Your task then
column2: <name>
column3: is to find someone here in Ironforge that is in need of aid. Someone who is pure of heart and motive. Perhaps someone helping others. Perhaps someone in need of a guide. Regardless
column4: the person must have noble intent and be relying on your kindness. Do this
column5: and return to me when you are finished. Then
column6: we shall discuss more of your path and what it means to be a paladin of the Light. I will remain here in the temple for your return. Other paladins will need my guidance also.

column1: The Tome of Divinity^12^Dwarf^Paladin^John Turner^John Turner^The Tome of Divinity^^^Bring 10 Linen Cloth to John Turner in Ironforge.^My wife and I run an orphanage in Stormwind
column2: mostly for children who have lost parents due to the attacks by the Scourge in the last decade. I come to Ironforge every month or so to see about collecting more supplies from the citizens here
column3: and talk to the various groups to see if they can do anything to help. This trip's been agonizingly slow
column4: and not very productive. If I could just get some more linen for my wife to make some clothes
column5: I could finally send a shipment home.

column1: The Tome of Valor^20^Alliance^Paladin^Tome of Valor^Duthorian Rall^The Tome of Valor^^^Speak to Duthorian Rall in Stormwind.^Valor
column2: and all the virtues that go along with it
column3: are like rare minerals: you must cherish them when you find them because of their value
column4: but you must also take time to harvest them... refine them. When mixed together properly
column5: a strong alloy is formed
column6: sometimes unbreakable by even the most powerful blows. This strength
column7: your faith
column8: your bravery
column9: must be tested. You must learn to never lose faith and realize that with the power of the Light
column10: you can overcome things that most others cannot.

column1: The Tome of Valor^20^Alliance^Paladin^Duthorian Rall^Daphne Stilwell^The Tome of Valor^^The Tome of Valor^Find Daphne Stilwell in Westfall.^Good! Your lack of hesitation is a sure sign that you are prepared and eager to test yourself. So be it. At the very ends of Westfall's Longshore
column2: a small house overlooks the ocean. There
column3: a couple lives
column4: the Stilwells. Jordan is an incredible smith
column5: and he's gone to Ironforge to meet with the dwarves for a while. But this has left Daphne
column6: his wife
column7: alone and unprotected. Reports suggest that the Defias have all but taken over the area
column8: Daphne may need some protection from the villains. Go there.

column1: The Tome of Valor^20^Alliance^Paladin^Daphne Stilwell^Daphne Stilwell^The Tome of Valor^The Tome of Valor^^Defend Daphne Stilwell from the Defias attack.^Now
column2: they'll be coming again soon
column3: I'd wager
column4: so get yourself ready. I've got myself a gun in the house. I'll grab it and be ready to help you out
column5: but for the most part
column6: you're on your own. I've no idea how many they'll send
column7: but I'm sure it'll be more than the few they sent earlier. Ask the Light for whatever blessings you can because... did you hear that? I think they're coming. We make our stand near the house!

column1: The Tome of Valor^20^Alliance^Paladin^Daphne Stilwell^Duthorian Rall^The Tome of Valor^^^Speak to Duthorian Rall in Stormwind.^Please
column2: return to Duthorian and let him know that I'm safe for now. I have you and the Church to thank for that. He'll send word to Ironforge to let my Jordan know that he has nothing to fear. Oh
column3: how I miss my husband. I can't wait till he returns.

column1: The Test of Righteousness^20^Alliance^Paladin^Duthorian Rall^Jordan Stilwell^The Tome of Valor^^Seeking the Kor Gem^Speak to Jordan Stilwell in Ironforge^Actually
column2: I have no doubt that Jordan himself would like to thank you
column3: and seeing as I need a messenger to send word that his wife is safe
column4: I think you'd be a perfect choice. Jordan was to be a paladin of the Light before his dedication to his father's craft took him on another path--he's intimately familiar with our way of life and is considered among our most faithful. He should still be in Ironforge--he likes to work outside the gates during the day
column5: something about the cool mountain air.

column1: The Test of Righteousness^22^Alliance^Paladin^Jordan Stilwell^Jordan Stilwell^The Tome of Valor^^^Using Jordan's Weapon Notes
column2: find some Whitestone Oak Lumber
column3: Bailor's Refined Ore Shipment
column4: Jordan's Smithing Hammer
column5: and a Kor Gem
column6: and return them to Jordan Stilwell in Ironforge.^I'd like to reward you if you'd be willing to accept such a thing? Don't misunderstand me
column7: my generosity is dependent on how much help you can be
column8: but I see us both benefiting greatly from such an alliance. I will craft for you a weapon worthy of what you've accomplished
column9: a symbol of paladinhood and the Light
column10: but you must gather the items I need to craft it. I've already started taking notes on the items
column11: it just requires someone brave and skilled enough to recover them. What do you say
column12: <class>?

column1: Bailor's Ore Shipment^22^Alliance^Paladin^Bailor Stonehand^Bailor Stonehand^^^^Bring Jordan's Ore Shipment to Bailor Stonehand in Loch Modan.^Ach
column2: ya startled me
column3: <man/woman>! Can't ya see I was lost in thought? What's that? Jordan's shipment... fer Ironforge. Ahhh
column4: yeah
column5: I know whatcha speak of. Mo'grosh ogres... dat's who took me ol' friend's ore shipment. Caravan was headin' here from the Wetlands and was ambushed. The guard who survived their attack just passed away a few days ago--healer couldn't get to 'em fast enough. If you want the shipment
column6: you'll have to head northeast across the Loch. It's got to be there somewhere.

column1: A Task Unfinished^5^All^Mulgore^Antur Fallow^Innkeeper Kauth^^^^Bring the Bundle of Furs to Innkeeper Kauth in Bloodhoof Village.^<name>
column2: please
column3: I beg of you
column4: can you help me? I have not finished my tasks here on the Mesa--I'm in the middle of my Rite of Strength--and my father asked me to deliver these furs to the inn in Bloodhoof. I'm far from rested enough to complete both my rite and this task for my father. Would you mind going on for me? The inn is pleasant and a perfect place to rest during your long travels. I'm sure you'll agree once you see it.

column1: Bartleby's Mug^10^Alliance^Warrior^Bartleby^Harry Burlguard^A Warrior's Training^^Marshal Haggard^Bring Bartleby's Mug to Burlguard^Ok
column2: here's my mug. Wait! Let me finish what's in it first... there we go.

column1: Marshal Haggard^10^Alliance^Warrior^Harry Burlguard^Marshal Haggard^Marshal Haggard^Bartleby's Mug^^Speak with Marshal Haggard.^You've learned a few moves
column2: but you could still use a decent weapon. I bet if you spoke with Marshal Haggard he could help you. Marshal Haggard lives in a manor in Elwynn Forest
column3: at the Eastvale Lumber Camp. He's retired now but he collected a lot of gear during his career. Let him know I sent you
column4: and with luck he'll have a spare weapon to offer.

column1: Dead-tooth Jack^10^Alliance^Warrior^Marshal Haggard^Marshal Haggard^Marshal Haggard^^^Retrieve Haggard's Badge from Dead-tooth Jack's camp
column2: and return to Marshal Haggard.^Burlguard sent you
column3: did he? Yes
column4: I have spare weapons around here
column5: but first I have a task for you... A while ago a Defias villain Dead-tooth Jack tricked me. It was dark and he was wearing a Stormwind tabard and I thought he was Marshal Dughan. He said he needed my old Stormwind Marshal's badge and I gave it to him... and then he laughed and ran off before I could catch him! Get back my badge! Dead-tooth Jack probably has it stowed in his camp to the south.

column1: Vejrek^10^Dwarf
column2: Gnome^Warrior^Muren Stormpike^Muren Stormpike^Muren Stormpike^^^Bring Vejrek's Head to Muren Stormpike in Ironforge.^If you want to rise in the ranks of the warriors
column3: then you better be tough. I can teach you new moves but before that
column4: prove to me you can handle yourself against real foes. Vejrek is the toughest troll you'll find in these parts
column5: and he's who you have to beat. He has a hut in the foothills just south of Frostmane Hold. Bring me Vejrek's head and I'll know you have mettle.

column1: Muren Stormpike^10^Dwarf
column2: Gnome^Warrior^Granis Swiftaxe^Muren Stormpike^Muren Stormpike^^Bartleby the Drunk^Speak with Muren Stormpike.^Hello
column3: warrior! You show a lot of promise
column4: but you still need to learn some tricks and Muren Stormpike is just the dwarf to teach you. You can find Muren at the Hall of Arms in the Military Ward of Ironforge. Talk to him when you're ready to learn what it is to be a warrior.

column1: Tormus Deepforge^11^Alliance^Warrior^Muren Stormpike^Tormus Deepforge^Muren Stormpike^^^Speak with Tormus Deepforge.^Now that you've learned some moves
column2: it's time to get you a decent weapon. Speak with Tormus Deepforge. He can make you a weapon I'm sure you'll like. You'll find Tormus here in Ironforge
column3: at the Great Forge.

column1: Ironband's Compound^11^Alliance^Warrior^Tormus Deepforge^Tormus Deepforge^Muren Stormpike^^Grey Iron Weapons^Bring a load of Umbral Ore to Tormus Deepforge in Ironforge.^My mentor
column2: Sturgy Ironband
column3: had a compound south of Helm's Bed Lake in eastern Dun Morogh. There he taught blacksmithing and he was the best. But one day
column4: one of his students brought him a load of strange ore. Master Ironband called it umbral ore and was eager to work with it
column5: but soon after it arrived... a band of Dark Iron dwarves attacked his compound. They killed everyone! Enter Ironband's compound
column6: <name>
column7: and avenge my master's death. And bring me the load of umbral ore that caused it.

column1: Vorlus Vilehoof^10^Alliance^Warrior^Elanaria^Elanaria^Elanaria^^The Shade of Elura^Bring the Horn of Vorlus to Elanaria in Darnassus.^Before I can teach you
column2: you must show me your resolve. The satyr Vorlus Vilehoof has found one of our remote moonwells
column3: southeast of the Ban'ethil Barrow Den. He now splashes within it
column4: defiling its pure waters with his filth. Find Vorlus at the moonwell and destroy him. Bring me his horn as proof and I will begin your advanced training as a warrior. The path to the moonwell is hidden well
column5: <name>
column6: but stay focused and alert and you will find it.

column1: Elanaria^10^Alliance^Warrior^Moon Priestess Amara^Elanaria^Elanaria^^Bartleby the Drunk^Speak with Elanaria.^Greetings
column2: warrior. Your skill grows
column3: but there is more to your profession than you may believe. To further progress
column4: you must soon find a teacher. The warrior Elanaria dwells in Darnassus
column5: at the Warrior's Terrace. She can instruct you.

column1: Gakin's Summons^10^Alliance^Warlock^Remen Marcot^Gakin the Darkbinder^Gakin's Summons^^^Report to Gakin the Darkbinder in the Mage Quarter of Stormwind.^Isn't that how it always works? Was looking for you all day and couldn't find you
column2: now when I'm not expecting it
column3: you come and walk right up to me. I've wasted enough time trying to find you
column4: so I won't delay you any longer. Master Gakin's summoned you for additional training. Seems to me you should seek him out as soon as possible. You'll find him in the basement of the Slaughtered Lamb tavern. By the way
column5: you might want to keep that particular location quiet. Don't want word spreading about it.

column1: The Shade of Elura^10^Alliance^Warrior^Elanaria^Elanaria^The Shade of Elura^Vorlus Vilehoof^^Bring 8 loads of Elunite Ore and the Medallion of Elura to Elanaria in Darnassus.^You have learned much
column2: <name>. Now we will craft you a weapon. A warrior's weapon. To do this
column3: you must travel to Darkshore. Long ago a ship crashed upon the rocks near the Auberdine lighthouse
column4: scattering many crates of elunite ore along the ocean floor. First
column5: you must defeat the elunite's guardian
column6: the Shade of Elura. Once the ship's captain
column7: she cursed herself to roam the deeps and protect her shipment for all time. Defeat her
column8: gain her medallion
column9: and gather the crates of lost Elunite.

column1: Surena Caledon^10^Alliance^Warlock^Gakin the Darkbinder^Gakin the Darkbinder^Gakin's Summons^^^Retrieve Surena's Choker for Gakin the Darkbinder in Stormwind.^I had a student named Surena Caledon. She stood where you stand now
column2: eager to learn of warlock magic
column3: and possessing no small bit of talent. More than that she was young and pleasing to the eye. Had I seen it then
column4: the traitorous trollop! The thieving wench ran off with one of the Defias
column5: Erlan Drudgemoor. While her loss is of little importance
column6: I gifted her a bloodstone choker that I must have. Her life means nothing to me now. You will find her at the Brackwell Pumpkin Patch. Retrieve what is mine.

column1: The Binding^10^Alliance^Warlock^Gakin the Darkbinder^Gakin the Darkbinder^Gakin's Summons^^^Using the Bloodstone Choker
column2: summon and subdue a voidwalker
column3: then return the Bloodstone Choker to Gakin the Darkbinder in Stormwind.^By retrieving my choker and besting Surena
column4: you've proven that you're at least as capable as she was. With that said
column5: I can tell you're direly in need of training. You can manage the flows of magic
column6: yes
column7: but being a warlock is much more than that. I will show you how to command a voidwalker
column8: but before I can
column9: you must call one forth at a summoning circle and subdue it using whatever weapons--physical and magical--you have at your disposal. Use the magic of this choker at the summoning circle below.

column1: Wastewander Justice^43^All^Tanaris^Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle^Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle^Wastewander Justice^^^Take down 10 Wastewander Bandits and Thieves east of Gadgetzan
