column2: then report back to Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle.^You there! It's time for you to be a big helper to the Gadgetzan Water Company. The Wastewander nomads out in the Tanaris desert have seized almost all the water wells! Without access to them
column3: our water supply will dry up in no time. If you want to get in our good graces
column4: then you'll help us bring justice to those nomads! Head east of here and bring down ten Wastewander Bandits and Thieves
column5: then report back to me on the double. Justice waits for no man... goblin... bah
column6: just get on it!

column1: More Wastewander Justice^44^All^Tanaris^Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle^Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle^Wastewander Justice^^^Take down 10 Wastewander Shadow Mages
column2: 8 Wastewander Rogues
column3: and 6 Wastewander Assassins for Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle in Gadgetzan.^We need you to take on the stronger ranks of the Wastewander nomads now. You've done a good job thus far
column4: but if we are to take back those water wells
column5: then it only makes sense to do it against as few nomads as possible! This time around we need you to take down their rogues
column6: assassins
column7: and shadow mages. You'll find them east and southeast of here. I'm not going to lie to you - they're a nasty lot. Do this for us though
column8: and we'll be on our way to taking back what is rightfully ours!

column1: Smith Mathiel^10^Alliance^Warrior^Elanaria^Mathiel^The Shade of Elura^^Weapons of Elunite^Bring the Case of Elunite to Smith Mathiel.^I have placed the elunite you gathered into a case. Take it to the blacksmith Mathiel
column2: and he will craft for you an elunite weapon. Mathiel is to the south
column3: on the other side of this building.

column1: Yorus Barleybrew^20^Alliance^Warrior^Wu Shen^Yorus Barleybrew^Yorus Barleybrew^^The Rethban Gauntlet^Speak with Yorus Barleybrew.^Yorus Barleybrew has issued a challenge to all able warriors of the Alliance. He waits at the Lakeshire Inn
column2: in Redridge
column3: and pledges a grand reward to anyone able to pass his trial.

column1: The Rethban Gauntlet^22^Alliance^Warrior^Yorus Barleybrew^Yorus Barleybrew^Yorus Barleybrew^^The Shieldsmith^Enter the Rethban Caverns
column2: reach the first fork
column3: and return to Yorus Barleybrew within the time allowed.^I call my challenge the Rethban Gauntlet. To pass the trial
column4: all you must do is enter the Rethban Caverns
column5: to the first fork
column6: then return here. Easy! Except there are a few wrinkles... You have to return within an hour. There are whole heaps of Redridge Gnolls in the way. Before you start
column7: you have to take a swig of my family's signature drink: Barleybrew Scalder! So what do you say? The Rethban Caverns are in the foothills north of Lakeshire. Are you ready to run the Rethban Gauntlet?

column1: Grimand Elmore^28^Alliance^Warrior^Furen Longbeard^Grimand Elmore^Grimand Elmore^Fire Hardened Mail^^Bring Furen's Notes to Grimand Elmore.^I made a copy of my notes on the techniques I learned while making your armor
column2: and I need them sent to Grimand Elmore. He's here in the Dwarven District
column3: in the weapon shop. And duck when you give these to him. He's fiercely proud of his skills
column4: and won't like the idea of learning something from me...

column1: Fire Hardened Mail^28^Alliance^Warrior^Furen Longbeard^Furen Longbeard^The Shieldsmith^^Grimand Elmore
column2: Mathiel
column3: Klockmort Spannerspan
column4: Furen's Armor^Gather the materials Furen Longbeard requires
column5: and bring them to him in Stormwind.^So I gave you a nice shield
column6: but we don't have to stop there. I know the secrets to make extremely hard mail armor. It's not easy and it takes very rare materials
column7: but if you're willing to do the legwork then I'll make a piece for you. What do you say
column8: <name>? If you're up for the challenge
column9: then I'll give you a list of what to get and where to get them.

column1: The Shieldsmith^22^Alliance^Warrior^Yorus Barleybrew^Furen Longbeard^The Shieldsmith^The Rethban Gauntlet^^Bring the Cask of Scalder to Furen Longbeard.^You really showed what you were made of when you ran the Rethban Gauntlet
column2: <name>. And I'm true to my word. I'll get you the reward I promised... Except it's in Stormwind. Talk to my friend
column3: Furen Longbeard
column4: in the Dwarven District of Stormwind. He's the best shieldsmith you'll ever meet
column5: and he owes me a big favor. Here
column6: take Furen this cask of Barleybrew Scalder and ask him for a shield. He'll give you a nice one.

column1: Mathiel^28^Alliance^Warrior^Furen Longbeard^Mathiel^Mathiel^Fire Hardened Mail^^Bring Furen's Notes to Mathiel.^I made a copy of my notes on the techniques I learned while making your armor
column2: and need them sent to the blacksmith Mathiel. He lives in Darnassus which is quite a long way off
column3: but I'm sure he'll be very grateful to learn what I've learned.

column1: Klockmort Spannerspan^28^Alliance^Warrior^Furen Longbeard^Klockmort Spannerspan^Klockmort Spannerspan^Fire Hardened Mail^^Bring Furen's Notes to Klockmort Spannerspan.^I made a copy of my notes on the techniques I learned while making your armor
column2: and need someone to take them to Klockmort Spannerspan. He's a gnomish blacksmith in Ironforge and when he learns what I've learned... I bet he'll pull off his own beard in excitement.

column1: Burning Blood^28^Alliance^Warrior^Grimand Elmore^Grimand Elmore^Grimand Elmore^^Grimand's Armor^Bring 20 vials of Burning Blood and 1 Burning Rock to Grimand Elmore in Stormwind.^I hate to admit that Furen might have really found something. But to be sure I'll need to try his techniques on a new piece of armor. If you help me with the materials
column2: <name>
column3: then you can have the armor. To make this armor
column4: I need samples of burning blood and a burning rock. The only place I know to get them is Duskwood. The Nightbane worgen based in the Roland's Doom mine have burning blood
column5: and their leader Gutspill will have the rock. May fortune grant you speed
column6: <name>.

column1: Water Pouch Bounty^44^All^Tanaris^Spigot Operator Luglunket^Spigot Operator Luglunket^^^Water Pouch Bounty^Bring 5 Wastewander Water Pouches to Spigot Operator Luglunket in Gadgetzan.^Greetings <name> - the name's Luglunket
column2: and we've got an important job for you if you're up for it! Huzzah! Nothing would please me more as a seasoned spigot operator to take any Wastewander water pouches you might find out in the desert. That's our water anyway - the nomads have just stolen it is all! The Gadgetzan Water Company will offer you an official care package for every five you turn in. Most importantly though
column3: you're helping Gadgetzan help itself!

column1: Iron Coral^29^Alliance^Warrior^Klockmort Spannerspan^Klockmort Spannerspan^Klockmort Spannerspan^^Klockmort's Creation^Bring 20 loads of Searing Coral to Klockmort Spannerspan in Ironforge.^I want to try Furen Longbeard's new techniques on my own piece of armor. And because you helped Furen and he helped me
column2: you're welcome to the armor after I make it! To finish the piece
column3: I need a special coral
column4: searing coral. It grows in only one place--along the coast south of Menethil Harbor in the Wetlands. Bring me enough searing coral and I'll get right to work on the armor. And hurry
column5: <name>. I'm so eager to get started it's making my toes twist!

column1: Sunscorched Shells^30^Alliance^Warrior^Mathiel^Mathiel^Mathiel^^Mathiel's Armor^Bring 20 Sunscorched Shells to Mathiel in Darnassus.^My colleague
column2: Furen Longbeard
column3: made a discovery which I am eager to test. I wish to try it on a new armor that I am researching
column4: for I believe Furen's techniques will produce superior results. Will you help me? If you gather what I need to make the armor
column5: then I will make an extra piece for you. I need the sunscorched egg shells of the Highperch Wyverns who dwell at Highperch
column6: in Thousand Needles. Search for the shells below their nests
column7: and return to me when you have a sufficient amount.

column1: Cyclonian^40^All^Warrior^Bath'rah the Windwatcher^Bath'rah the Windwatcher^The Windwatcher^^^Bring the items on Bath'rah's Parchment to Bath'rah the Windwatcher in Alterac.^I have spent ages watching this site. I watch
column2: so that one day I might see the great Cyclonian fall. But I have not yet found a champion to defeat the wind lord. Perhaps you are that champion. Prove it to me. Gather the items I need to summon Cyclonian
column3: and I will know you are a great warrior. Perhaps then you can defeat him and gain his whirlwind heart. If so
column4: then I will infuse the heart's power in a weapon
column5: and I will give that weapon to you. Here is a parchment with the items I need.

column1: The Summoning^40^All^Warrior^Bath'rah the Windwatcher^Bath'rah the Windwatcher^The Windwatcher^^Whirlwind Weapon^Bring the Whirlwind Heart to Bath'rah Windwatcher.^I am ready to perform the ritual to summon Cyclonian. When he is summoned
column2: you must defeat him and take his whirlwind heart. This I will use to instill a weapon with Cyclonian's power. <name>
column3: are you ready to face the wind lord?

column1: The Slaughtered Lamb^10^Alliance^Warlock^Lago Blackwrench^Gakin the Darkbinder^^^^Report to Gakin the Darkbinder in the Mage Quarter of Stormwind.^Hmph. Times past
column2: all warlocks in Khaz Modan were trained under the auspices of the masters of Gnomeregan
column3: but now that we've all been forced to relocate into this rat's hole in Ironforge
column4: and Magni's decided to keep a careful watch on us
column5: we're forced to send our novices to Stormwind for training. Luckily
column6: Gakin's no slouch
column7: so you'll still learn what you need to know
column8: but it burns my blood! Anyways
column9: you'll find Gakin in the basement of the Slaughtered Lamb in Stormwind.

column1: Devourer of Souls^20^Alliance^Warlock^Gakin the Darkbinder^Takar the Seer^Gakin's Summons^^^Speak with Takar the Seer in the Barrens.^A succubus is a devourer of souls
column2: destroyer of hearts
column3: and dominator of minds. It knows nothing but evil. This will be the creature you will learn to summon and control
column4: but it cannot be brought into our world without a stimulus. With a symbol of love as bait
column5: it will surely answer your call. Then you can defeat it
column6: and make it your tool. It will be hard to find something of this nature
column7: though. You should speak with Takar the Seer. You will find him in the Barrens of Kalimdor near Camp Taurajo.

column1: Gakin's Summons^20^Alliance^Warlock^Lago Blackwrench^Gakin the Darkbinder^Gakin's Summons^^^Report to Gakin the Darkbinder in the Mage Quarter of Stormwind.^<name>! Didn't expect to see you around these parts
column2: but I was instructed to keep an eye out for you. It's past time you got some more training
column3: so you should stop in to see Gakin the next time you're in Stormwind. He'll be waiting for you.

column1: The Islander^30^All^Warrior^Torm Ragetotem^Klannoc Macleod^The Islander^^^Speak with Klannoc Macleod.^Your renown as a warrior grows
column2: <name>. Now it is time to pit yourself against your peers and see where you stand. There is an island off the coast of the Barrens
column3: south of Ratchet. It is called Fray Island and it is a place where warriors meet. Meet
column4: and fight. Speak with the chief warrior of Fray Island
column5: Klannoc Macleod. If he finds you worthy
column6: then Klannoc will lead you further down the warrior's path. To reach Fray Island
column7: search for the sand bar shallows along the Merchant Coast.

column1: The Affray^30^All^Warrior^Klannoc Macleod^Klannoc Macleod^The Islander^^The Windwatcher^Kill Big Will
column2: then speak to Klannoc Macleod on Fray Island.^If you want to learn from me
column3: then you must first pass The Affray. It is a challenge we on Fray Island like to offer rising warriors who think they're tough
column4: and if you can pass this test then I'll know you are. To begin
column5: walk into the middle of that crowd yonder and step on the grate. That'll tell Twiggy Flathead you're ready
column6: and he'll send challengers against you. Beat all the challengers and he'll call out Big Will. Kill Big Will
column7: and return to me in the time we allow.

column1: Heartswood^20^Alliance^Warlock^Takar the Seer^Gakin the Darkbinder^Gakin's Summons^^^Retrieve the Heartswood from Ashenvale and bring it to Gakin the Darkbinder in the Mage Quarter of Stormwind.^In preparation for your coming
column2: I used my sight to look over the world and through the mists of time. I have found what it is you seek. In the War of the Ancients
column3: two lovers fell together in battle. Where they took their last breaths
column4: a tree known as the heartswood grew
column5: a symbol of their undying love. That should be enough to tempt a succubus. You will find it in the ruins of Ordil'Aran in the northwestern part of the forest of Ashenvale.

column1: The Binding^20^Alliance^Warlock^Gakin the Darkbinder^Gakin the Darkbinder^Gakin's Summons^^^Using the Heartswood Core
column2: summon and subdue a succubus
column3: then return the Heartswood Core to Gakin the Darkbinder in the Slaughtered Lamb.^Using the heartswood core
column4: you will be able to cast a spell at the summoning circle in the crypt below to open a portal for the succubus to pass through. Be careful
column5: <name>
column6: succubi have overrun even the strongest of minds. Once you have bested and returned it to the void
column7: return to me and I will show you how to call and control it.

column1: The Orb of Soran'ruk^25^All^Warlock^Doan Karhan^Doan Karhan^^^^Find 3 Soran'ruk Fragments and 1 Large Soran'ruk Fragment and return them to Doan Karhan in the Barrens.^When demons of the Legion fall out of favor
column2: their spirits are imprisoned within orbs and distributed to their mages and warlocks. Many were carried by their servants in Azeroth. Even fragmented
column3: they still possess the powers of the demons trapped inside. The orb of Soran'ruk was broken into two pieces
column4: one was further broken to be used by the acolytes of the Twilight's Hammer in Blackfathom Deeps. The other
column5: larger piece
column6: was possessed by a wizard in Shadowfang Keep. Find them and I can reform it.

column1: Tome of the Cabal^30^Alliance^Warlock^Strahad Farsan^Krom Stoutarm^Seeking Strahad^^^Speak with Krom Stoutarm in Ironforge.^It will take more than a simple summoning circle to bring forth a felhunter for you to challenge. My three acolytes and I will assist in creating the magic circles. You require a copy of the Tome of the Cabal
column2: which has been lost to us for some time. It was written by the first group of warlocks to summon a felhunter unaided. Perhaps Krom Stoutarm can help you with this. An itinerant warlock these days
column3: he spends his days hoarding ancient texts and skulking about the library in Ironforge.

column1: The Tome of Divinity^12^Dwarf^Paladin^John Turner^Tiza Battleforge^The Tome of Divinity^^^Speak to Tiza Battleforge in Ironforge.^I'm going to see about making plans to return home soon. Hopefully
column2: Stephanie is doing well back in Stormwind. I can't wait to see her again. Till next we meet
column3: <class>.

column1: The Tome of Divinity^12^Dwarf^Paladin^Tiza Battleforge^Muiredon Battleforge^The Tome of Divinity^^^Take the Symbol of Life and speak to Muiredon Battleforge in Ironforge.^I want you to take this
column2: <name>. It is called the Symbol of Life. You've proven charitable and patient
column3: and now I want you to prove just how adept you've become in both combat
column4: and power. My husband Muiredon returned recently from an encounter with some Dark Iron dwarves
column5: and he barely escaped with his life--he's over there having his wounds healed by one of our priests. Take the Symbol and speak to him. If you can help him
column6: then we will speak again soon. May the Light shine upon you.

column1: The Tome of Divinity^12^Human^Paladin^Stephanie Turner^Duthorian Rall^The Tome of Divinity^^^Speak to Duthorian Rall in Stormwind.^I'll take these to the children this very day. Please be safe
column2: good <class>. It is not often <men/women> of your character show their faces in the city
column3: but you've proven that the paladins here in Stormwind shall never turn their backs on those in need. Farewell.

column1: The Tome of Divinity^12^Human^Paladin^Duthorian Rall^Gazin Tenorm^The Tome of Divinity^^^Take the Symbol of Life to Gazin Tenorm in Stormwind.^Take this
column2: <name>. It is called the Symbol of Life. You've proven charitable and patient
column3: and now the time has come to see if you're powerful enough to focus one of the Light's greatest gifts. My friend Gazin returned recently from an encounter with some Defias in Elwynn near Heroes' Vigil--he barely escaped with his life. He's near the altar having his wounds healed by our priests. Take the Symbol and speak to him. If you can help him
column4: then we will speak again soon. May you bask in the Light's glory.

column1: The Tome of Divinity^12^Dwarf^Paladin^Muiredon Battleforge^Narm Faulk^The Tome of Divinity^^^Take the Symbol of Life and resurrect Narm Faulk in Dun Morogh.^We was spyin' on some of the Dark Iron dwarves that've bunkered down south of Helm's Bed Lake. We knew they was up to no good
column2: so Narm an' me thought we'd take a closer look--got ta see their leader given orders to some o' his men. Narm an' me took the chance to kill a few of 'em
column3: but they proved tougher than we thought
column4: an' more of 'em got the jump on us. Narm tol' me to run an' get support
column5: so 'ere I am. Narm needs help
column6: an' I'll not rest till he gets it. C'n ya help
column7: <name>?

column1: The Tome of Divinity^12^Dwarf^Paladin^Narm Faulk^Muiredon Battleforge^The Tome of Divinity^^^Retrieve a Dark Iron Script from the Dark Iron dwarves near Helm's Bed
column2: and return to Muiredon Battleforge in Ironforge.^Before I fell in battle
column3: Muiredon and I had almost defeated one of the Dark Iron spies near that small house. We witnessed their captain passing orders to them
column4: and sought to kill him and take the orders. Some of the council in Ironforge do not yet believe the presence of Dark Iron dwarves exists in Dun Morogh. By attaining one of those scripts
column5: we'll not only have proof of their movements
column6: but possibly an idea of what they're planning. Get one of those scripts and take it back to Muiredon
column7: <name>.

column1: The Tome of Divinity^12^Dwarf^Paladin^Muiredon Battleforge^Tiza Battleforge^The Tome of Divinity^^^Speak to Tiza Battleforge in Ironforge.^I c'n see me wife's o'er there beamin' wit pride already. Ya better get yer tuchus o'er there pronto. I be thinkin' she'd have some words wit ya. Light be witcha
column2: mighty <class>. I'll be lookin' fer ya on the battlefield against the Scourge and dem Dark Irons when the time comes.

column1: The Tome of Divinity^12^Human^Paladin^Gazin Tenorm^Henze Faulk^The Tome of Divinity^^^Take the Symbol of Life and resurrect Henze Faulk in Elwynn.^Henze and I had made it to Heroes' Vigil
column2: an island in the middle of Stone Cairn Lake in northeastern Elwynn. We'd heard the Defias had infiltrated our borders and we wanted proof to take to the king's advisors. We caught sight of a couple of the scum going over some documents
column3: and we attacked. Unfortunately
column4: we were quickly overwhelmed by more of the mages. Henze held them off for me while I escaped... the daft fool
column5: going and being brave. He's out there now
column6: Henze is. Can you help us
column7: <name>?

column1: The Tome of Divinity^12^Human^Paladin^Henze Faulk^Gazin Tenorm^The Tome of Divinity^^^Retrieve a Defias Script from the Defias Rogue Wizards in Elwynn
column2: and return to Gazin Tenorm in Stormwind.^We'll have time to talk more about the Symbol at a later time. What's important now is to get those papers we saw the Defias going over. If we can get our hands on them
column3: we'll be able to prove the Defias have infiltrated Elwynn and hopefully gain some insight into what their plans are. I'm in no shape for battle as of now
column4: <name>. Do you think you're strong enough to get those papers from the Defias here on the island? If you're able to get them
column5: bring them back to Gazin and let him know I'm all right.

column1: The Tome of Divinity^12^Human^Paladin^Gazin Tenorm^Duthorian Rall^The Tome of Divinity^^^Speak to Duthorian Rall in Stormwind.^I'll take the script to the King's advisors after Duthorian's taken a look at them
column2: but in the meantime
column3: you should go speak to Duthorian now. He'll be wanting to pat you on the back for sure! Thank you again
column4: <name>. I hope we meet again. You're surely an ally I'm proud to call friend.

column1: The Windwatcher^30^All^Warrior^Klannoc Macleod^Bath'rah the Windwatcher^The Windwatcher^The Affray^^Speak with Bath'rah the Windwatcher.^Now that you've learned your berserker's stance
column2: you'll want a nice weapon to use it with. Talk to Bath'rah the Windwatcher
column3: a troll hermit who lives between the Alterac Mountains and the Western Plaguelands. He is a skilled weapon maker and a powerful shaman. To find Bath'rah
column4: go to the river that flows along Tarren Mill's eastern flank. Follow it north--Bath'rah is camped near ruins that rest along the river's eastern bank.

column1: The Binding^30^All^Warlock^Strahad Farsan^Strahad Farsan^Seeking Strahad^^^Using the Tome of the Cabal
column2: summon and subdue a felhunter
column3: then return the Tome of the Cabal to Strahad Farsan in Ratchet.^If you are sufficiently prepared
column4: then we should begin. Let me explain the process to you. I will begin by creating the basic summoning circle. When that is finished
column5: my acolytes will use the rods of channeling to create the greater circle. Once that is done
column6: read the incantation from the Tome of the Cabal
column7: and the felhunter will be pulled forth. Be careful
column8: <name>. A felhunter is a powerful foe
column9: and I'd like to see you keep your head on your shoulders.

column1: Components for the Enchanted Gold Bloodrobe^31^All^Warlock^Menara Voidrender^Menara Voidrender^In Search of Menara Voidrender^^^Bring Robes of the Arcana to Menara Voidrender in the Barrens.^The first item I will aid you in creating is a robe. You will gather the items for me
column2: and we will put them together. Afterwards
column3: assuming you succeed
column4: you will have the first of many items that will make you more powerful and aid you in your struggles. To start
column5: you must have crafted Robes of Arcana. A tailor can make this for you
column6: or perhaps you can purchase one from someone else--I'd be most impressed if you could make it yourself--but regardless
column7: bring me the robes
column8: and we shall go from there.

column1: Seeking Strahad^30^Alliance^Warlock^Lago Blackwrench^Strahad Farsan^Seeking Strahad^^^Speak with Strahad Farsan in the Barrens.^It is time you learned the felhunter summoning
column2: <name>. I do not have the reagents and items necessary to teach you here
column3: so you will have to seek out another
column4: Strahad Farsan
column5: another of our inner circle. He makes his residence in the goblin port of Ratchet. I will send word ahead of you to inform him of your coming.

column1: Fragments of the Orb of Orahil^40^All^Warlock^Menara Voidrender^Tabetha^Knowledge of the Orb of Orahil^^^Speak to Menara's acolytes inside the tower above Ratchet and choose one of their paths to follow.^Good
column2: then we shall begin. The first thing you must do is speak to my acolytes inside. Choose one of their paths to follow--they will explain more. Second
column3: you must travel to Desolace and find an Infernal Orb from one of the warlocks of Mannoroc Coven. It is that orb that you will cleanse with the help of a mage named Tabetha deep in southern Dustwallow Marsh. She will aid you because of our history together. Again
column4: do not come back until you have done both things I've asked.

column1: Tome of the Cabal^30^Horde^Warlock^Strahad Farsan^Jorah Annison^Tome of the Cabal^^^Speak with Jorah Annison in the Undercity.^It will take more than a simple summoning circle to bring forth a felhunter for you to challenge. My three acolytes and I will assist in creating the magic circles. You require a copy of the Tome of the Cabal
column2: which has been lost to us for some time. It was written by the first group of warlocks to summon a felhunter unaided. Perhaps Jorah Annison can help you with this. He's employed as a cartographer in the Undercity these days
column3: but still knows more of ancient texts than any I know.

column1: Tome of the Cabal^30^Alliance^Warlock^Krom Stoutarm^Krom Stoutarm^Seeking Strahad^^^Retrieve the Moldy Tome and Tattered Manuscript for Krom Stoutarm in Ironforge.^It was lost
column2: but there's some idea as to where it might be found. There was only one copy ever made and it was vandalized at some point
column3: a large portion of it ripped from the binding. Rumor has it that it somehow passed into the hands of the centaur of Thousand Needles. The rest was lost off the coast west of Southshore
column4: where it was to be transported to Menethil Harbor by boat. It never arrived. In exchange for this knowledge
column5: all I ask is that if you find it
column6: bring it to me to see.

column1: Tome of the Cabal^30^Horde^Warlock^Jorah Annison^Jorah Annison^Tome of the Cabal^^^Retrieve the Moldy Tome and Tattered Manuscript for Jorah Annison in the Undercity.^Ah! I see that you are a warlock of similar tastes to mine. Indeed
column2: acquiring the Tome of the Cabal is a worthy aspiration. Did you know that it was once held within the walls of Lordaeron? It was vandalized though
column3: almost half its pages removed. Who would commit such a heinous act? That half is lost
column4: though rumor says that it fell into the hands of the centaur of the Thousand Needles. The rest of the text was to be transferred to Ironforge
column5: but was lost in transit on the coast west of Southshore.

column1: Tome of the Cabal^30^Alliance^Warlock^Krom Stoutarm^Strahad Farsan^Seeking Strahad^^The Binding^Bring the Reconstructed Tome and 3 Rods of Channeling to Strahad Farsan in Ratchet.^Well
column2: ah
column3: it's hard to let it go. But you found it
column4: and you have more important things to do with it
column5: of course. Just
column6: please
column7: be sure to mention to Strahad that I wanted a copy. While you were out
column8: he sent a message for you. He wanted me to tell you that for his acolytes to assist with the summoning
column9: you'll have to acquire three rods of channeling. He might not know where to find them
column10: but I do! They were last used by the orcs of the Dragonmaw clan in the Wetlands. I'd check their spellcasters!

column1: Tome of the Cabal^30^Horde^Warlock^Jorah Annison^Strahad Farsan^Tome of the Cabal^^The Binding^Bring the Reconstructed Tome and 3 Rods of Channeling to Strahad Farsan in Ratchet.^This is one of the most interesting texts I have perused in the last few years. The selection here is sparse--mostly books on geography--and I have already read them all. I should hope that Strahad would send me a copy of this tome when he has the chance. Speaking of him
column2: he sent word to me while you were away. For your task
column3: you must obtain three rods of channeling. For allowing me to look at this text
column4: I will share a secret: You can find the rods on orcs of the Dragonmaw Clan in the Wetlands.

column1: The Test of Righteousness^22^Alliance^Paladin^Jordan Stilwell^Jordan Stilwell^The Tome of Valor^^^Wait for Jordan Stilwell to finish forging a weapon for you.^Why don't we go over to the forge and get started on this? I've been preparing for your arrival for some time
column2: so it shouldn't take long at all. When we're done
column3: you'll be far more prepared to defend the Light than you have been
column4: this much I swear. I'll be somewhat honest
column5: <name>
column6: seeing the results of your exploits makes me somewhat envious. But knowing that I can contribute to your adventures in my own significant way does bring me some joy.

column1: Speak with Dillinger^10^Horde^Warrior^Austil de Mon^Deathguard Dillinger^Speak with Dillinger^^Path of Defense^Speak with Deathguard Dillinger in Brill.^I was told Deathguard Dillinger has a job for someone like you. If you're willing to show your value to the Dark Lady's forces
column2: then report to Dillinger immediately. Deathguard Dillinger's post is on the west end of Brill
column3: near the graveyard.

column1: Ulag the Cleaver^10^Horde^Warrior^Deathguard Dillinger^Deathguard Dillinger^Speak with Dillinger^^^Kill Ulag the Cleaver
column2: then speak with Deathguard Dillinger.^When the Scourge swept through Tirisfal Glades
column3: we captured one to study. He had a free mind
column4: and called himself Ulag the Cleaver. But
column5: although his will was free
column6: he was still enthralled by the Lich King. We hoped to find a way to break the king's control over Ulag
column7: but we failed. Now
column8: finally
column9: it is time to free him. Free him
column10: and kill him. Activate the skull stone trigger near the mausoleum to the north. This will lift the magical seal that binds him. Then... be ready
column11: <name>.

column1: Speak with Coleman^10^Horde^Warrior^Deathguard Dillinger^Coleman Farthing^Speak with Dillinger^^^Speak with Coleman Farthing.^You have proven your value to the Dark Lady
column2: now perhaps you can prove yourself to one of her subjects. Coleman Farthing awaits a warrior who is willing to be his instrument of revenge against the Forsaken's enemies. You will find him in the Gallow's End Tavern in eastern Brill.

column1: Agamand Heirlooms^11^Horde^Warrior^Coleman Farthing^Coleman Farthing^Speak with Dillinger^^Heirloom Weapon^Bring Coleman Farthing the Agamand Family Axe
column2: the Agamand Family Sword
column3: the Agamand Family Mace and the Agamand Family dagger.^The Agamand family were my employers in life
column4: and they were the cause of my death! It is fitting that the Agamands are now mindless minions of the Lich King. Now I would have their last vestiges of honor. Go into their family crypt and rob them of their family heirlooms: a sword
column5: an axe
column6: a dagger and a mace. Bring them to me! The Agamand family crypt is at the north end of the Agamand mills
column7: protected by lurking Scourge and dead Agamands.

column1: Speak with Ruga^20^Horde^Warrior^Sorek^Ruga Ragetotem^Speak with Ruga^^^Speak with Ruga Ragetotem.^You are a warrior of skill and growing renown. Perhaps you are ready for Ruga Ragetotem's trial? If so
column2: then find Ruga in Camp Taurajo in the Barrens. He awaits those warriors who answer his call.

column1: Trial at the Field of Giants^20^Horde^Warrior^Ruga Ragetotem^Ruga Ragetotem^Speak with Ruga^^^Bring 5 twitching antennae to Ruga Ragetotem at Camp Taurajo^To pass this trial
column2: you must travel south to the Field of Giants. There you will find a host of crawling
column3: insect creatures. They are new to the Barrens and I do not like what they herald. Bring me their still-twitching antennae
column4: and waste no time
column5: <name>
column6: for harvested antennae will not twitch for long. Bring me the antennae in the time allowed
column7: and you will pass the trial.

column1: Speak with Thun'grim^20^Horde^Warrior^Ruga Ragetotem^Thun'grim Firegaze^Speak with Ruga^^^Speak with Thun'grim Firegaze in the Barrens.^Thun'grim Firegaze
column2: an orc blacksmith of renown
column3: has heard of your continued deeds of valor in service of the Horde. He would like to fashion for you a suit of armor
column4: and bids you speak with him immediately. Thun'grim is camped east of the Crossroads in the Barrens.

column1: Brutal Armor^30^Horde^Warrior^Thun'grim Firegaze^Thun'grim Firegaze^Speak with Ruga^^Ula'elek and the Brutal Gauntlets
column2: Orm Stonehoof and the Brutal Helm
column3: Velora Nitely and the Brutal Legguards
column4: Brutal Hauberk^Bring to Thun'grim Firegaze 15 Smoky Iron Ingots
column5: 10 Powdered Azurite
column6: 10 Iron Bars and a Vial of Phlogiston.^I have heard tales of your strength and valor
column7: and wish to make for you a suit of armor
column8: a companion to aid you as tales of your great deeds grow. But the fashioning of this armor will be a quest unto itself
column9: <name>. I will need your help
column10: and the help of other smiths of the Horde. Here
column11: take this scroll. I spent many nights
column12: struggling with near-blind eyes
column13: writing that which I need for the armor. Bring me the items on this scroll and I will create for you the first piece of the suit.

column1: Ula'elek and the Brutal Gauntlets^30^Horde^Warrior^Thun'grim Firegaze^Ula'elek^Ula'elek and the Brutal Gauntlets^Brutal Armor^^Speak with Ula'elek in Durotar.^The troll smith Ula'elek will craft for you the brutal gauntlets. He dwells in Durotar
column2: in Sen'jin Village with his Darkspear brethren
column3: and he awaits your coming.

column1: Orm Stonehoof and the Brutal Helm^30^Horde^Warrior^Thun'grim Firegaze^Orm Stonehoof^Orm Stonehoof and the Brutal Helm^Brutal Armor^^Speak with Orm Stonehoof in Thunder Bluff.^Orm Stonehoof is respected greatly for his skill. He will make for you the brutal helm. Seek him out in Thunder Bluff
column2: near the pool by the city's great
column3: central totem.

column1: Velora Nitely and the Brutal Legguards^30^Horde^Warrior^Thun'grim Firegaze^Velora Nitely^Velora Nitely and the Brutal Legguards^Brutal Armor^^Speak with Velora Nitely in the Undercity.^It is said that
column2: before her death
column3: Velora Nitely was one of the finest armorsmiths in Lordaeron. Death
column4: it seems
column5: has not decreased her talents. Speak with Velora--she will make your brutal legguards. Velora plies her trade in the Undercity of Lordaeron
column6: in the trade quarter.

column1: Satyr Hooves^30^Horde^Warrior^Ula'elek^Ula'elek^Ula'elek and the Brutal Gauntlets^^Brutal Gauntlets^Bring 7 Uncloven Satyr Hooves to Ula'elek at Sen'jin Village in Durotar.^I can make you a pair of brutal gauntlets
column2: and great magic will they hold. But first
column3: you must collect this magic and bring it to me. The satyrs dwell in northeastern Ashenvale because of the forest's power. They feed off its purity
column4: leeching and corrupting. You can tell which satyrs have drawn the most of Ashenvale's magic by their swollen
column5: uncloven hooves. These hooves hold great power. I will need them for your gauntlets' crafting.

column1: Chimaeric Horn^30^Horde^Warrior^Orm Stonehoof^Orm Stonehoof^Orm Stonehoof and the Brutal Helm^^Brutal Helm^Bring a Galvanized Horn to Orm Stonehoof in Thunder Bluff.^I will make you the helm
column2: but you must show me you are worthy of it. Nestled in the southwestern reaches of the Stonetalon Mountains lies the Charred Vale. It was once a verdant place
column3: but is now defiled and ashen
column4: and what creatures remain there are mad with pain and despair. That place is where I send you
column5: <name>. You must go to the Charred Vale and find a chimaera matriarch. Slay her
column6: free her of her misery. Bring me her galvanized horn as proof
column7: and I shall make for you the helm.

column1: Dragonmaw Shinbones^30^Horde^Warrior^Velora Nitely^Velora Nitely^Velora Nitely and the Brutal Legguards^^Brutal Legguards^Bring 8 Sturdy Dragonmaw Shinbones to Velora Nitely in the Undercity.^To make the brutal leg guards
column2: I need a brace of sturdy shinbones. The Dragonmaw orcs of the Wetlands have nice
column3: thick shinbones. I'll need theirs. But they must be sturdy. Be sure to test the shinbones as you collect them. If you can break them with your bare hands
column4: then they won't be sturdy enough to work with.

column1: The Shattered Hand^13^Horde^Rogue^Therzok^Therzok^Therzok^^^Steal Tazan's key
column2: then use it to open his Satchel and deliver its contents to Therzok in the Cleft of Shadow in Orgrimmar.^I'll leave it to you to get Tazan's satchel open
column3: and return to me with its contents. The locking mechanism is complex
column4: so it would probably be easiest if you obtained the key. As you didn't find it on Tazan's body
column5: I can only assume that he left the key in the care of another... Ah
column6: yes
column7: that's right. He had an assistant named Gamon. A drunkard
column8: you'll most likely find him at the tavern. Perhaps you could quietly relieve him of the key.

column1: Therzok^10^Horde^Rogue^Kaplak^Therzok^Therzok^^The Shattered Hand^Speak with Therzok in the Cleft of Shadow in Orgrimmar.^Lower your voice
column2: <name>. Yeah
column3: I know your name. Was told to keep an eye out for an orc by your description. From what we've heard about you
column4: you can handle yourself in combat
column5: and aren't opposed to a little sneakery from time to time. Am I right? Anyways
column6: you should go see Therzok in Orgrimmar. He's got an offer for you to hear.

column1: Speak with Jennea^10^Alliance^Mage^Zaldimar Wefhellt^Jennea Cannon^Speak with Jennea^^Mirror Lake^Speak with Jennea Cannon in Stormwind.^We mages have a task that needs doing. One that is vital to the safety of Stormwind and Elwynn forest. Jennea Cannon has the details. She studies in the wizard's sanctum
column2: in the mage district of Stormwind. You should make your way to her with haste.

column1: Mirror Lake^10^Human^Mage^Jennea Cannon^Jennea Cannon^Speak with Jennea^^^Bring a Mirror Lake sample to Jennea Cannon in Stormwind.^This world has been victim to massive mystic struggles
column2: which tore magic currents from once stable channels. We struggle to determine the effects these changes have caused
column3: and some of us fear the worst! But I will reveal more of this later. Right now
column4: we need you to gather information. Here
column5: take this flask. Go to the base of the waterfall at Mirror Lake
column6: southwest of the Stormwind gates
column7: and retrieve a sample of the water there. Return it to me so that I might test it for magical taints.

column1: Speak with Bink^10^Alliance^Mage^Magis Sparkmantle^Bink^Speak with Bink^^Mirror Lake^Speak with Bink in Ironforge.^<name>! Bink
column2: my gnome colleague in Ironforge
column3: sends word. She has a task that needs doing and won't rely on anyone but a mage to do it! Are you that mage
column4: <name>? If so
column5: then speak with Bink. She spends her time in the Hall of Mysteries in the Mystic Ward of Ironforge.

column1: Mage-tastic Gizmonitor^10^Alliance^Mage^Bink^Bink^Speak with Bink^^^Bring Bink her Mage-tastic Gizmonitor.^We mages do more than just waggle our fingers and make pretty sparks! We control magic
column2: the base fabric of our world! And that takes great care
column3: and resolve. And knowledge... so much knowledge! One of my devices
column4: the mage-tastic gizmonitor
column5: collects and stores that knowledge in huge amounts! But it's lost! When we fled our home of Gnomeregan
column6: I left it in a chest in one of our huts outside the city
column7: and now the place is crawling with leper gnomes! Please
column8: <name>
column9: retrieve my gizmonitor!

column1: Speak with Anastasia^10^Horde^Mage^Cain Firesong^Anastasia Hartwell^Speak with Anastasia^^The Balnir Farmstead^Speak with Anastasia Hartwell.^<name>
column2: Anastasia Hartwell has a task for someone of your talents. Speak with her in the Magic Quarter of the Undercity
column3: and prepare yourself for your first task for the mages of the Forsaken.

column1: The Balnir Farmstead^10^Horde^Mage^Anastasia Hartwell^Anastasia Hartwell^Speak with Anastasia^^^Bring Balnir Snapdragons to Anastasia Hartwell in the Mage Quarter of the Undercity.^The Plaguelands to the east are an aberration. Devised by the Lich King
column2: they spread their magic into the soil
column3: corrupting and killing all that live. Although there is a certain charm to the destructive forces of the plague
column4: we
column5: the mages of the Forsaken
column6: believe it is unruly and must be curtailed. But first
column7: we must measure how far it has spread into Tirisfal. Go to the Balnir Farmstead in eastern Tirisfal. In the garden are flowers--snapdragons. Gather these and return.

column1: Speak with Un'thuwa^10^Horde^Mage^Uthel'nay^Un'Thuwa^Speak with Un'thuwa^^The Balnir Farmstead^Speak with Un'thuwa.^Un'thuwa
column2: tribal mage of Sen'jin Village
column3: detects a disturbance in the magic currents of Durotar and asks for aid. Speak with Un'thuwa and do what you can to help him. Do this
column4: and in time further secrets will be revealed to you.

column1: Ju-Ju Heaps^10^Horde^Mage^Un'Thuwa^Un'Thuwa^Speak with Un'thuwa^^^Destroy 4 Ju-Ju Heaps
column2: then return to Un'thuwa in Sen'jin Village.^The warlock Zalazane of the Echo Isles has disrupted the normal flow of magic in Durotar. He does this through tainted fetishes
column3: ju-ju heaps
column4: which he has placed among his huts on the main Echo Isle. These heaps corrupt our wildlife and give power to the warlocks and infernal creatures that lurk in the land's dark corners. You must destroy the ju-ju heaps
column5: <name>
column6: before the flow of magic is forever altered.

column1: Mennet Carkad^10^Horde^Rogue^Marion Call^Mennet Carkad^Mennet Carkad^^The Shattered Hand
column2: The Deathstalkers^Speak with Mennet Carkad in the Rogues' Quarter of the Undercity.^<name>? Not quite what I was expecting
column3: considering Carkad himself has taken an interest to you. Looks can be deceiving though
column4: right? Either way
column5: you should go see him as soon as possible. You wouldn't want to know what happened to the last few that chose to ignore his summons.

column1: The Befouled Element^27^Horde^Ashenvale^Befouled Water Globe^Mastok Wrilehiss^The Befouled Element^^^Bring the Befouled Water Globe to Mastok Wrilehiss at Splintertree Post
column2: Ashenvale.^The slain elemental has produced an intensely glowing globe of water. The contents of the globe are
column3: at best
column4: disgusting. It would be safe to assume that whatever has befouled the water of Mystral Lake is most likely present in the water of the globe. It's not exactly common knowledge who might be interested in such a find; perhaps the person who originally sent you out to the lake
column5: Mastok Wrilehiss at Splintertree Post
column6: might have an idea.

column1: Report to Jennea^15^Alliance^Mage^Zaldimar Wefhellt^Jennea Cannon^Report to Jennea^^^Speak with Jennea Cannon in Stormwind.^Your knowledge of the craft grows
column2: young <name>. Are you now ready to begin your true lessons? Are you ready to take your place in the secret war we wage? If so
column3: then speak with Jennea Cannon
column4: in the wizard's sanctum in the mage district of Stormwind. She has a task for you which will open your first window into the invisible world.

column1: Investigate the Blue Recluse^16^Alliance^Mage^Jennea Cannon^Jennea Cannon^Report to Jennea^^^Obtain a Cantation of Manifestation and a Chest of Containment coffers from behind Jennea Cannon. Bring 3 Filled Containment Coffers to Jennea at the Wizard's Sanctum.^A disturbance has been reported at the Blue Recluse tavern in the Mage Quarter. Strange
column2: invisible creatures now wander the tavern
column3: and I fear a mana rift has formed there. I want you to investigate the tavern and capture those creatures. Use the cantation of manifestation in the tavern to make the creatures visible
column4: subdue them then use a containment coffer to capture them. When you have enough
column5: return to me with your filled coffers
column6: your empty coffers and the cantation.

column1: Gathering Materials^15^Alliance^Mage^Jennea Cannon^Wynne Larson^Report to Jennea^^Manaweave Robe^Bring 10 Linen Cloth and the 6 Charged Rift Gems to Wynne Larson in Stormwind.^You have served your fellow mages well
column2: and now it is time to don your wizard's robe. Wynne Larson can make your robe
column3: but you must bring her the needed materials The robe will be made of linen which is easy to find
column4: but you must also gain charged rift gems
column5: and the only known location of the gems is in the Silver Stream Mine of Loch Modan
column6: left in crates by the dwarven miners' league. Gather the linen and the gems and bring them to Wynne Larson at the Larson Clothiers in the Mage District.

column1: Ur's Treatise on Shadow Magic^28^Alliance^Mage^High Sorcerer Andromath^High Sorcerer Andromath^High Sorcerer Andromath^^^Bring Ur's Treatise on Shadow Magic to High Sorcerer Andromath in Stormwind.^Long ago
column2: three mages studied in this tower until one fell to the dark arts. He was urged to turn away from that evil magic
column3: but he could not resist. And so he was banished. The fallen mage's new domain is the tower of Ilgalar in Redridge
column4: and he took with him a powerful book--Ur's Treatise on Shadow Magic. We
column5: the mages of Stormwind
column6: would have that book returned. Enter the tower of Ilgalar
column7: find the tome in his library
column8: and bring it to me.

column1: High Sorcerer Andromath^26^Alliance^Mage^Bink^High Sorcerer Andromath^High Sorcerer Andromath^^^Speak with High Sorcerer Andromath.^High Sorcerer Andromath wishes to speak with you
column2: <name>. He is at the top of the wizard's sanctum
column3: in the mage's district of Stormwind. It would be wise to speak with him
column4: for Andromath is one of the most powerful mages not locked away in Dalaran. Council with him is high council indeed.

column1: Pristine Spider Silk^26^Alliance^Mage^High Sorcerer Andromath^Wynne Larson^High Sorcerer Andromath^^Astral Knot Garment^Bring 8 Pristine Spider Silk to Wynne Larson in Stormwind.^Your service has been unwavering
column2: <name>. I think
column3: perhaps
column4: it is time you had a finer garment
column5: one more suiting your station as an adept mage. If you gather the needed materials
column6: then we will arrange the robe made. You must enter Duskwood and hunt carrion recluse spiders. Extract their silk
column7: but only the finest
column8: most pristine silk will do. When you have enough
column9: take it to Wynne Larson
column10: here in the mage district at the Larson Clothiers. She will craft your robe.

column1: Speak with Deino^26^Horde^Mage^Anastasia Hartwell^Deino^Speak with Deino^^^Speak with Deino.^The troll mage Deino has need of your assistance
column2: <name>. She resides in Orgrimmar
column3: in the Darkbriar Lodge.

column1: Waters of Xavian^26^Horde^Mage^Deino^Deino^Speak with Deino^^^Bring the Xavian Water Sample to Deino in Orgrimmar.^The fabled city of Xavian lies nestled deep within eastern Ashenvale
column2: and tales of its ancient knowledge are well known among the learned. It is said that the waters of Xavian hold vast magical powers. I would have a sample of those waters
column3: from their source. Take this flask and go to Xavian. Gather water from the bottom of its highest waterfall
column4: and return to me. And use care as you move through that ancient city--satyrs now hold the ruins and do not like mages prying into their affairs.

column1: Laughing Sisters^26^Horde^Mage^Deino^Kil'hala^Speak with Deino^^Nether-lace Garment^Bring 12 Laughing Sister's Hairs to Kil'hala at the Crossroads.^For your services
column2: I have arranged for the creation of your new robes
column3: provided you can gather the needed materials... For these robes
column4: you must return to Ashenvale for the locks of hair from laughing sisters--dryads who gather near the Raynewood Retreat. When you have their hair
column5: bring it to Kil'hala
column6: a troll tailor at the Crossroads in the Barrens. He will be expecting you
column7: and will fashion your robes.

column1: Journey to the Marsh^38^All^Mage^Jennea Cannon^Tabetha^^^Hidden Secrets^Speak with Tabetha.^Now it is time for you to earn your mage's wand. To begin this quest
column2: speak with the human hermit Tabetha in Dustwallow Marsh. You will find her shack deep in the marsh
column3: west of Theramore. Speak with her
column4: for her knowledge is vast. You will find Tabetha's cottage west of Theramore
column5: and just north of the Stonemaul Ruins.

column1: Items of Power^40^All^Mage^Tabetha^Tabetha^^^^Bring 1 Jade and the Bolt Charged Bramble to Tabetha in Dustwallow Marsh.^The building of a mage's wand is not easy. Rare substances are required
column2: and a vessel must be made that can store great quantities of magical energy. You must gather these things and bring them to me. I have written onto this parchment that which you need
column3: and instructions on how to get it. Bring me exactly what is on this list
column4: and follow my written directions to the letter
column5: for if you do not then when we make your wand things might go... badly.

column1: Hidden Secrets^38^All^Mage^Tabetha^Magus Tirth^Hidden Secrets^Journey to the Marsh^^Speak with Magus Tirth in the Shimmering Flats.^To make your wand
column2: there are key passages in a certain book that I must read. The book is called Rituals of Power
column3: written by the Magus Tirth. I do not have a copy of his book
column4: and none of the world's great libraries possess it. So you must speak with Tirth and gain it from him. Good luck. Tirth used to be a great mage and scholar
column5: but now he spends his time at the gnome and goblin races in the Shimmering Flats
column6: drinking and gambling.

column1: Get the Scoop^30^All^Mage^Magus Tirth^Magus Tirth^Hidden Secrets^^^Find the phrase to Tirth's strongbox
column2: then return to Tirth.^I can help you with the book
column3: but first you have to help me! The tome you seek is in my magically locked strongbox. To open it a special phrase must be uttered
column4: and I can't remember the phrase! Normally my assistant helps me remember these things but he's nowhere to be found. If you want my book
column5: then find my apprentice! Ask around the race track--if you're lucky then someone has seen him. Either drag him back here
column6: or at least get my magic phrase from him so we can open my box!

column1: Rituals of Power^40^All^Mage^Magus Tirth^Tabetha^Hidden Secrets^^Mage's Wand^Bring the book Rituals of Power to Tabetha in Dustwallow Marsh.^Hm... now that I think about it
column2: I don't have my book! You see
column3: I had some gambling debts and to pay them off I sold the last copy of Rituals of Power to a member of the clergy.... A member of the Scarlet Brotherhood. He must have taken it to their library in the Scarlet Monastery in Tirisfal Glades! If you want that book
column4: then you'll have to go to the monastery to find it. And sorry about all the trouble. I'm not myself these days...

column1: Mage's Wand^40^All^Mage^Tabetha^Tabetha^^Rituals of Power^^Speak with Tabetha after her ritual.^I'll go make the wands now.
Return to the Marsh^40^All^Mage^Anastasia Hartwell^Tabetha^Return to the Marsh^^^Speak with Tabetha.^It is time
column2: <name>
column3: for you to speak with Tabetha... the hermit of Dustwallow Marsh. She will instruct you on the creation of a powerful mage's implement. Tabetha's shack lies deep in Dustwallow Marsh
column4: west of Theramore.

column1: The Infernal Orb^40^All^Mage^Tabetha^Tabetha^Return to the Marsh^^^Bring an Infernal Orb to Tabetha in Dustwallow Marsh.^The first step is to acquire an orb with power. The warlocks of the Burning Blade have nice
column2: high quality orbs... it's too bad they've bound demons into them! But we can fix that
column3: yes we can. Go to Desolace and snatch an infernal orb from a Burning Blade summoner. You'll find summoners at the Mannoroc Coven. When you have the orb
column4: return to me.

column1: The Exorcism^40^All^Mage^Tabetha^Tabetha^Return to the Marsh^^^Kill the Demon of the Orb
column2: then speak with Tabetha.^Now that we have a summoner's orb
column3: we must exorcise the demon within it. I can do that. That's the easy part. You're the one who has the hard job. You're the one who has to kill the demon once it's out. And you'll have to be quick. If you take too long then he'll jump back in the orb and we'll have to start over! So get yourself ready. Prepare your strongest spells and keep your potions handy
column4: and go get a friend if you have one. Because this isn't going to be pretty.

column1: Power in Uldaman^40^All^Mage^Tabetha^Tabetha^Return to the Marsh^^^Retrieve an Obsidian Power Source and bring it to Tabetha in Dustwallow Marsh.^Now that the demon has been removed
column2: we must gain a power source. Unfortunately
column3: the best power sources are usually the oldest and the hardest to get. It's neat how fate likes to take a bite out of you sometimes
column4: isn't it? So you're going to need to go to Uldaman and defeat the obsidian sentinel there. He's big
column5: he's tough
column6: and his power source packs a punch! I wish you the best of luck
column7: <name>. And if you don't get lucky then
column8: well... it was nice knowing you.

column1: Mana Surges^40^All^Mage^Tabetha^Tabetha^Return to the Marsh^^Celestial Power^Kill 12 Mana Surges in the allowed time limit.^We are almost finished
column2: but this last step is the most perilous
column3: <name>. I have the empty summoner's orb and am ready to empower it. We will do this by harnessing the energy of a mana rift. I'll cast a spell that will temporarily open a rift
column4: from which creatures
column5: mana surges
column6: will pour out. You must defeat the mana surges and their power will be released
column7: which I will then collect. Kill enough mana surges before the rift closes and I will place all their collected energy in your orb.

column1: Report to Anastasia^15^Horde^Mage^Cain Firesong^Anastasia Hartwell^Report to Anastasia^^^Speak with Anastasia Hartwell.^The mages of the Undercity have noted a magical disturbance within the city
column2: and have sent word for mages of the Horde to investigate. Anastasia Hartwell can tell you more. Speak with her in the Magic Quarter in the Undercity.

column1: Investigate the Alchemist Shop^16^Horde^Mage^Anastasia Hartwell^Anastasia Hartwell^Report to Anastasia^^^Obtain a Cantation of Manifestation and a Chest of Containment Coffers from behind Anastasia Hartwell. Bring 3 Filled Containment Coffers
column2: the Chest of Containment Coffers and the Cantation of Manifestation to Anastasia in the Undercity.^Algernon's alchemist shop in the Apothecarium is the locus of a strange disturbance. Invisible creatures
column3: made solely of magic
column4: wander the shop--there must be a reason
column5: and we must find it! Investigate the disturbance and capture those creatures. Take a chest of coffers and a scroll from behind me. Use the scroll at the shop to make the creatures visible
column6: subdue them with your spells
column7: then throw down a coffer to capture them. Return with the filled coffers
column8: the empty coffers and the cantation.

column1: Gathering Materials^15^Horde^Mage^Anastasia Hartwell^Josef Gregorian^Report to Anastasia^^Spellfire Robes^Bring 10 Linen Cloth and 6 Dalaran Mana Gems to Josef Gregorian.^It is time for you to don your first mage's robes
column2: <name>. They are a sign of your station
column3: and a testament to your worth. To gain the robes
column4: you must gather the mana gems from the Dalaran mages of Silverpine. Their beliefs are similar to ours and so killing them is somewhat distasteful
column5: but if they lack the strength to resist us
column6: then they do not deserve their lives. Bring the gems and a supply of linen to Josef Gregorian at the Magic Quarter's tailor shop.

column1: The Shattered Hand^13^Horde^Rogue^Therzok^Therzok^Therzok^^^Kill Tazan and bring his Satchel to Therzok in the Cleft of Shadow in Orgrimmar.^The Warchief is too subtle in his methods. He is cautious to unleash the might of the Horde. Once we were stronger
column2: mighty conquerors all. That pride we must regain
column3: and the Shattered Hand will do so. We build strength from the shadows and strike at the exposed
column4: secretly laying our enemies low. A task you must complete for me
column5: to prove your worth. The troll Tazan trades with the pirates near Ratchet. He has information I must have. Kill him and bring me his satchel.

column1: Fenwick Thatros^16^Horde^Rogue^Mennet Carkad^Mennet Carkad^Fenwick Thatros^^^Kill Fenwick Thatros and bring his head back to Mennet Carkad in the Rogues' Quarter of the Undercity.^Lord Varimathras has just sent me a missive about a threat to the Forsaken that must be immediately removed. His name is Fenwick Thatros
column2: one whom Lord Varimathras believes is a leader of the undead that have taken root in Silverpine Forest. Your name came to mind immediately
column3: <name>. I have faith enough in your abilities that you will carry out this mission flawlessly. The latest reports from the Deathstalkers in Silverpine indicate that Thatros can be found near the decrepit dock on Lordamere.

column1: Tools of the Trade^20^Horde^Rogue^Mennet Carkad^Mennet Carkad^Fenwick Thatros^^^Find the Dalaran Status Report and return it to Mennet Carkad in the Rogues' Quarter of the Undercity.^The wizards of the Kirin Tor at Ambermill have stored away important documents pertaining to the current state of Dalaran. This we know from the admissions of one of our prisoners. Lord Varimathras has placed the duty of recovering them in the hands of the Deathstalkers. This task falls to you
column2: <name>. You will need some equipment
column3: however
column4: and the knowledge of lockpicking. Speak with Estelle Gendry
column5: our outfitter
column6: and ask her for a set of tools before you set out.

column1: Tools of the Trade^16^All^Rogue^Mennet Carkad^Therzok^Rokar Bladeshadow^^^Return to Therzok in the Cleft of Shadow in Orgrimmar.^Here you go
column2: <name>. These should serve you well. Crafted by my own hand
column3: I swear you'll find none better. Do not bother to tell me your business
column4: however. I have no interest in Therzok's schemes
column5: I wish only to live out my retirement in peace. If you should ever need another set of tools
column6: come back to me
column7: and I will furnish you with a new set. But have a care with them!

column1: Bingles' Missing Supplies^15^Alliance^Loch Modan^Bingles Blastenheimer^Bingles Blastenheimer^Find Bingles^^^Find and return Bingles' supplies:^As if crashing into the Loch wasn't bad enough
column2: troggs from the nearby island attacked me and stole my tools and special Blastenheimer Blastencapper explosives. With no gyrocopter and no explosives
column3: the movement has no chance! Get my tools back and find my Blastencapper explosives
column4: <name>. For Gnomeregan!

column1: Find Bingles^15^Alliance^Ironforge^Gnoarn^Bingles Blastenheimer^Find Bingles^^^Find Bingles Blastenheimer in Loch Modan.^We've lost contact with Bingles! He was sent on a reconnaissance mission over Gnomeregan and hasn't reported back in over a week. I just know he's gone and blown himself up. He was last seen flying over the Loch. Perhaps you can investigate
column2: <name>.

column1: Underground Assault^20^Alliance^The Deadmines^Shoni the Shilent^Shoni the Shilent^Speak with Shoni^^^Retrieve the Gnoam Sprecklesprocket from the Deadmines and return it to Shoni the Shilent in Stormwind.^Gnomeregan has fallen under the control of those dastardly troggs! The situation is grave but perhaps you can help
column2: <name>. Deep in the Deadmines is a functional goblin shredder. Find that shredder and bring back the intact power supply. With the shredder's power supply
column3: we can give our gyrodrillmatic excavationators the power they need to break through the rocky underground borders of Gnomeregan
column4: opening the way for a gnomish assault!

column1: Speak with Shoni^15^Alliance^Ironforge^Gnoarn^Shoni the Shilent^Speak with Shoni^^^Speak with Shoni the Shilent at the Dwarven District in Stormwind.^Perhaps... Perhaps you can help us in the battle for Gnomeregan. In Stormwind you will find the commander of our underground assault crew
column2: Shoni the Shilent. Shoni needs assistance with her gyrodrillmatic excavationators. You will probably find her amongst the dwarves in Stormwind. Good luck
column3: <name>.

column1: Gyromast's Revenge^20^All^Darkshore^Gelkak Gyromast^Gelkak Gyromast^Gyromast's Retrieval^^^Find Gelkak's First Mate
column2: the Threshwackonator 4100
column3: and lead it back to Gelkak.^Landlubber
column4: ye needs to find me first mate. Take this'n key
column5: puts it in his gulliver an' bring him back here to serve the Cap'n. Them murlocs an' their chief ain't gonna be too happy once me first mate gets a hold of em!

column1: Gyromast's Retrieval^20^All^Darkshore^Gelkak Gyromast^Gelkak Gyromast^Gyromast's Retrieval^^^Find and return the three pieces of Gelkak's Key to Gelkak Gyromast.^A pirate's life ain't an easy one
column2: landlubber. It ain't all about plunderin' and booze! Alas
column3: me ship be sunk just off shore thanks to them pesky Threshadons. What I be needin' is me first mate back in workin' order! When I washed up'n shore
column4: the key for me first mate broke on the rocks and was pilfered by the beasties of Darkshore. Out of the corner of me eyes I saw some of them Ragin' Crawlers
column5: Ferocious Foreststrider
column6: and murloc rummaging through the wreckage....

column1: Plagued Lands^14^All^Darkshore^Tharnariun Treetender^Tharnariun Treetender^Plagued Lands^^^Capture a living Rabid Thistle Bear and bring it back to Tharnariun.^A sickness spreads across the Darkshore
column2: gripping the minds and bodies of all it touches. The Thistle Bears have been hit the hardest by this plague. The once noble beasts are now an instrument of destruction - rabid and frenzied. I may have a cure for this ailment. Take this trap to the forest and lay it on the ground. Any Rabid Thistle Bear that crosses the light shall become docile for a short time. Once the bear is docile
column3: it shall follow you. Lead it back here
column4: <name>.

column1: Cleansing of the Infected^16^All^Darkshore^Tharnariun Treetender^Tharnariun Treetender^Plagued Lands^^Tharnariun's Hope^Cleanse the forest of 20 Rabid Thistle Bears and return to Tharnariun Treetender in Darkshore.^As I had feared
column2: the cure does not work. It saddens me greatly to order the death of any of nature's beasts
column3: but the sick and tainted thistle bears must be put down. Return to the forest and destroy 20 rabid thistle bears
column4: <name>. It will most certainly not put a stop to the plague but it will slow down the damage the animals are doing to our forest and its inhabitants for a short time.

column1: Tharnariun's Hope^18^All^Darkshore^Tharnariun Treetender^Tharnariun Treetender^^Cleansing of the Infected^^Find and kill the Den Mother.^The survival of our people and lands comes at unfortunate costs
column2: <name>. You have spilled the blood of nature's servants; many sick animals you have felled. The people of Auberdine are indebted to you
column3: for the forest's pain is eased - even if only for a moment. I have one final task for you
column4: but be warned
column5: you will have to kill again. It is my hope that this will be the last time I call upon you
column6: <name>. In a cave to the northeast
column7: near Bashal'Aran
column8: resides the Den Mother. Slay her.

column1: Rest and Relaxation^5^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Falkhaan Isenstrider^Innkeeper Farley^^^^Speak with Innkeeper Farley at the Lion's Pride Inn.^Every adventurer should rest when exhaustion sets in - and there is no finer place to get rest and relaxation than at the Lion's Pride Inn! My best friend
column2: Innkeeper Farley
column3: runs the Lion's Pride. If you tell him I sent you
column4: he may give you the special discounted rates on food and drink. To find the Lion's Pride Inn
column5: travel south along the road from here -- you can't miss it!

column1: Dolanaar Delivery^5^Alliance^Teldrassil^Porthannius^Innkeeper Keldamyr^^^^Bring the Dolanaar Delivery to Innkeeper Keldamyr.^Greetings
column2: young <class>. Can you offer me aid? I have a package of herbs that I must deliver to the town of Dolanaar. But I still have business with the druids of Shadowglen and cannot yet leave. Can you deliver this package for me? It must be sent to Innkeeper Keldamyr
column3: at the Dolanaar inn. It lies along the road
column4: to the south.

column1: Supplies to Tannok^5^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Hands Springsprocket^Tannok Frosthammer^^^^Deliver the Crate of Inn Supplies to Tannok Frosthammer in Kharanos.^Hey! You look like a hearty adventurer. If you're planning on braving the pass
column2: do you suppose you could bring a package to the inn in Kharanos? You were planning on stopping at the inn
column3: right? If you make it through the pass
column4: you'll definitely want to take a breather there. Anyways
column5: bring this to Tannok Frosthammer
column6: the innkeeper's assistant. I can't get through the pass myself
column7: and it'll be days until a Mountaineer escort comes through!

column1: A Peon's Burden^5^Horde^Durotar^Ukor^Innkeeper Grosk^^^^Bring Ukor's Burden to Innkeeper Grosk in Razor Hill.^Excuse me? Can you help me? I have a load of food here. I walked along the road and braved scorpids and spiders and worse! I brought the food to the Valley of Trials because I thought they needed it and I like to help out. But they don't need any food! Now I have to take it back to Razor Hill and I'm afraid of all the beasts along the way... Can you take it for me? I'm just a peon
column2: but you're a hero. You fear nothing! Take it to Innkeeper Grosk at the Razor Hill inn. Thank you!

column1: Easy Strider Living^12^All^Cooking^Alanndarian Nightsong^Alanndarian Nightsong^^^^Bring back 5 Strider Meat to Alanndarian Nightsong in Auberdine.^Do you smell that delicious aroma? It's my secret recipe
column2: <name>--fresh strider stew. Delicious! Perhaps you would be interested in learning the recipe? Before I teach you the recipe
column3: you will need to prove that you can handle the beasts. Now
column4: I don't expect you to go out and tame one and ride it back to me
column5: but if you can kill a few and bring back some of their succulent meat
column6: I may be persuaded to show you the ways of strider stew.

column1: The Shattered Necklace^41^Alliance^Badlands^Shattered Necklace^Talvash del Kissel^The Shattered Necklace^^^Search for the original creator of the shattered necklace to learn of its potential value.^You have found a tarnished necklace
column2: though the tarnish belies intricate and magical craftsmanship. The necklace has been shattered
column3: as its setting appears to be missing three gems. On the underside of the necklace is the faint imprint of the city seal for Ironforge. Below the seal are three tiny
column4: engraved letters: "TdK". If there is anything to be gleaned from the necklace
column5: you will need to learn about its origins. Perhaps the seal and the initials are a start...

column1: Lore for a Price^41^Alliance^Ironforge^Talvash del Kissel^Talvash del Kissel^The Shattered Necklace^^^Bring five silver bars to Talvash del Kissel in Ironforge.^I am a jeweler of great renown here in Ironforge! Well
column2: former renown anyway... I have fallen onto hard times due to the chicanery of a competitor! A bad reputation in this business spells financial disaster. As a result
column3: I find myself without a copper to my good-though-currently-sullied name. I want you to get me five silver bars to finish an order I received - the first in what seems like an eternity. You get me those five silver bars
column4: and I'll answer your questions on the necklace.

column1: Back to Uldaman^42^Alliance^Gnomeregan Exiles^Talvash del Kissel^Remains of a Paladin^The Shattered Necklace^^^Search for clues as to the current disposition of Talvash's necklace within Uldaman. The slain paladin he mentioned was the person who had it last.^A competitor of mine started a rumor that my necklace cursed the paladin. Needless to say
column2: no one wants to buy cursed items from a jeweler. <name>
column3: I'll make you a deal - find the gems and I'll reassemble the necklace
column4: so long as you'll advertise that I do NOT make cursed items! Try looking for clues in Uldaman; maybe see if the paladin's body is down there
column5: since he's the one who we know had it last! When you find the gems you should use this; it'll allow you to contact me here in Ironforge.

column1: Find the Gems^43^Alliance^Ironforge^Remains of a Paladin^Talvash del Kissel^The Shattered Necklace^^^Find the ruby
column2: sapphire
column3: and topaz that are scattered throughout Uldaman. Once acquired
column4: contact Talvash del Kissel remotely by using the Phial of Scrying he previously gave you.^The paladin's journal has provided perhaps the only clues that Uldaman will yield as to the location of the necklace's gems. If the paladin's scribing remains accurate
column5: then the Shadowforge dwarves and the troggs that vie for control of the dig site will need to be dealt with. Armed with this knowledge
column6: the search for the gems begins in earnest. When all the gems have been acquired
column7: Talvash in Ironforge should be notified via the Phial of Scrying as per his instructions.

column1: Uldaman Reagent Run^42^Horde^Badlands^Jarkal Mossmeld^Jarkal Mossmeld^Badlands Reagent Run^^Badlands Reagent Run II^Bring 12 Magenta Fungus Caps to Jarkal Mossmeld in Kargath.^I've heard about a newly discovered plant called the magenta fungus caps. They grow in clusters at the Uldaman dig site and can be found in the early tunnels and deep within the less-explored areas. I want to study their potential use in alchemy
column2: and that's where you come in. Find the magenta cap clusters and bring me a dozen caps. Be warned
column3: the clusters may spew out poison spores if jostled. Do this for me
column4: and I'll whip up a batch of one of my famous restorative elixirs for you!

column1: Badlands Reagent Run II^44^Horde^Badlands^Jarkal Mossmeld^Jarkal Mossmeld^^Uldaman Reagent Run^^Use the empty thaumaturgy vessels on scorched guardian dragons found in the Badlands. Once you have them filled
column2: bring them to Jarkal Mossmeld in Kargath.^You have been most helpful to me
column3: <class>. I would reward you with the very recipe for the brew I gave you earlier... but I would ask of you a task that is quite dangerous. Hear my request. This lockbox contains three empty thaumaturgy vessels; they are imbued with an attunement aura that will drain the blood of a scorched guardian dragon. Using one on the beast will anger it greatly
column4: so be warned. Once you have all three filled
column5: bring them to me. Do this
column6: and the recipe will be yours.

column1: Restoring the Necklace^44^Alliance^Ironforge^Talvash del Kissel^Talvash del Kissel^The Shattered Necklace^^Restoring the Necklace^Obtain a power source from the most powerful construct you can find in Uldaman
column2: and deliver it to Talvash del Kissel in Ironforge.^You are going to need to find some "oomph" for the necklace
column3: and Uldaman is probably the best place for it
column4: actually. I guess there are a lot of constructs running around in there
column5: yeah? Well
column6: take out the biggest
column7: baddest construct in that place and grab its power source! I am pretty sure I can fuse that source into the necklace. Without that power source
column8: fixing the necklace will be impossible. Come back to me here to Ironforge when you have it
column9: and we'll get it all fixed up for you!

column1: Seek out SI: 7^10^Alliance^Rogue^Keryn Sylvius^Master Mathias Shaw^^^Snatch and Grab^Deliver Keryn Sylvius's package to Master Mathias Shaw at the Stormwind Barracks.^The badge? Oh
column2: it's nothing
column3: fish - nothing you could handle anyhow. By the looks of you
column4: I'd say Mathias is likely to mistake you for the cheese delivery <boy/girl> instead of a proper rogue. Regardless
column5: I've been assigned a job and I've made a promise to deliver on that job. Speaking of which
column6: deliver this package to Mathias and he may give you a small task or two. Get cracking.

column1: Snatch and Grab^10^Alliance^Rogue^Master Mathias Shaw^Master Mathias Shaw^^^^Find the Defias Dockmaster and recover the Shipping Schedule for Master Mathias Shaw.^Our operatives in the field are reporting heavy Defias activity south of Goldshire. The reports indicate that the Defias have taken over Jerod's Landing and are now using it as a way to smuggle large quantities of contraband from Redridge to Westfall. I need you to infiltrate the dock house and get me that shipping schedule
column2: <name>. You will probably find it buried deep in the pockets of the Dockmaster. ...and <name>
column3: should you be discovered
column4: SI:7 will disavow all knowledge of your existence.

column1: Road to Salvation^10^Alliance^Rogue^Hogral Bakkan^Hulfdan Blackbeard^Road to Salvation^^^Speak with Hulfdan Blackbeard in Ironforge.^Another lost soul looking for guidance
column2: eh? I suppose you want to find a purpose - your purpose. I've seen it a thousand times
column3: another hero looking for work. Well
column4: today's your lucky day
column5: friend. Hogral's got the cure for your ailment. Here's what you do: Take this road here up to Ironforge and make your way to the Forlorn Cavern. Once there
column6: locate the thieves' guild and speak with Hulfdan Blackbeard. He'll put you on the road to salvation.

column1: Simple Subterfugin'^10^Alliance^Rogue^Hulfdan Blackbeard^Onin MacHammar^Road to Salvation^^^Find Onin MacHammar by Gnomeregan.^Ye see
column2: the King be strip mining the quarry fer ore and gems. More riches than any one dwarf should see in ten lifetimes. The Hidden Circle has values
column3: <name>. We value valuables. Can ye understand? Now we feels the King should be sharing some of that booty
column4: but we don't want ol' 'Stinkbeard' to know he's sharin' - if ye catch me drift. We needs ye to speak with Onin MacHammar over by Gnomeregan and bring back a report. The crafty dwarf has hidden hisself amongst the lepers. Be careful.

column1: Onin's Report^10^Alliance^Rogue^Onin MacHammar^Hulfdan Blackbeard^Road to Salvation^^^Take Onin's Report back to Hulfdan in Ironforge.^The Quarry? Yap
column2: I see those monstrous armored steam tanks come by this post near every day. My contacts to the east tell me that the tank starts off at Ironforge
column3: makes a pickup at the Gol'Bolar Quarry
column4: stops over at Kharanos to refuel and then for some blasted reason
column5: it takes the long way around past Gnomeregan
column6: before reaching Ironforge to drop off the shipment. It's all in the report
column7: <race>. Take it back to Hulfdan so he can plan the next step.

column1: The Hidden Chamber^40^Alliance^Ironforge^Baelog^Prospector Stormpike^The Lost Dwarves^^^Read Baelog's Journal
column2: explore the hidden chamber
column3: then report to Prospector Stormpike.^Now for the task at hand. There is a secret chamber
column4: the Chamber of Khaz'mul
column5: that must be explored. The problem is that the chamber's behind a huge
column6: locked door! It's a lucky thing I know how to open it. I've described everything in my journal
column7: here on the table. My band and I are stuck here for now... so you
column8: <name>
column9: must find the chamber of Khaz'mul for us! Read my journal
column10: explore the chamber
column11: then report to Prospector Stormpike at the Explorers' League in Ironforge.

column1: The Apple Falls^10^Alliance^Rogue^Jannok Breezesong^Syurna^^^Destiny Calls^Take Jannok's Rose to Syurna in Darnassus.^They say I'm 'lovestruck
column2: ' whatever that means. Sure
column3: I spend my every waking moment thinking about Syurna. Sure
column4: my home is full of paintings and drawings of Syurna. Sure
column5: I often go days without eating
column6: sleeping
column7: or drinking
column8: while I lament about the love we could have had. Is that so wrong? Now she won't see me! ME! I've tried sending her messages but she won't even talk to another person unless they are a rogue. Could you deliver this flower to her? Don't forget to tell her it's from Jannok.

column1: Destiny Calls^10^Alliance^Rogue^Syurna^Syurna^^The Apple FallsRequires one ofThe Apple Falls^^Find Sethir the Ancient and bring back any clues that you may discover to Syurna.^We believe there is one being that may be able to help us understand what is happening to the forests of Teldrassil. Unfortunately
column2: getting the creature to cooperate has proven disastrous. He hides on a branch at the outskirts of the Oracle Glade. All who have so far approached the satyr
column3: whether through force or diplomacy
column4: have met with doom. Perhaps stealth is the answer
column5: <name>. Find what Sethir the Ancient carries in his packs and report back to me.

column1: Badlands Reagent Run^39^Horde^Badlands^Jarkal Mossmeld^Jarkal Mossmeld^Badlands Reagent Run^^^Bring 5 Buzzard Gizzards
column2: 10 Crag Coyote Fangs
column3: and 5 Rock Elemental Shards to Jarkal Mossmeld in Kargath
column4: Badlands.^<name>
column5: I could use your aid if you're up for it. I am an alchemist of some note
column6: and I seek your aid in acquiring some reagents found out in the Badlands. I need the following items to replenish my stocks: five buzzard gizzards
column7: ten crag coyote fangs
column8: and five rock elemental shards. Obviously
column9: you can get them off of the beasties themselves; if you're not the fighting type
column10: then find friends who are. Acquire these items for me
column11: you'll get some coin out of the deal. Watcha wanna do?

column1: Erion Shadewhisper^16^Alliance^Rogue^Jannok Breezesong^Erion Shadewhisper^Erion Shadewhisper^^Erion's Behest^Contact Erion Shadewhisper in Darnassus.^Do not worry
column2: <name>
column3: I am not sending you to see Syurna. Erion requires your presence at the Cenarion Enclave. Make haste!

column1: Erion's Behest^16^Alliance^Rogue^Erion Shadewhisper^Renzik "The Shiv"^Erion Shadewhisper^^^Travel to Stormwind City and seek council with Renzik "The Shiv."^Word of your deeds has spread far and wide
column2: <name>. So far
column3: in fact
column4: that Stormwind Intelligence has asked for you by name. The journey is taxing and not without peril
column5: but an opportunity to train under SI:7 should not be taken lightly. A new world awaits you
column6: <name>. Make your way to Old Town in Stormwind and speak with Renzik "The Shiv" at SI:7 headquarters.

column1: The Platinum Discs^47^All^^The Discs of Norgannon^The Discs of Norgannon^^^The Platinum Discs
column2: The Platinum Discs^Speak with stone watcher and learn what ancient lore it keeps. Once you have learned what lore it has to offer
column3: activate the Discs of Norgannon.^The centerpieces of this treasure chamber are four huge platinum discs
column4: each adorned with numerous sigils of an unknown origin. Touching them makes your hand tingle. Just after touching the discs
