column5: the visage of a large stone watcher springs forth. "Salutations. I am a keeper of knowledge. The Creators' synthesis of the Earthen has been chronicled and stored here for this world in the Discs of Norgannon." You have uncovered a wealth of previously undiscovered worldly lore!

column1: The Platinum Discs^47^Alliance^Ironforge^The Discs of Norgannon^High Explorer Magellas^The Platinum Discs^The Platinum Discs^The Platinum Discs^Take the miniature version of the Discs of Norgannon to the Explorers' League in Ironforge.^Touching the Discs of Norgannon once again makes your hand tingle. This time
column2: however
column3: a strange grinding noise is heard from inside the discs. Your backpack suddenly becomes heavier than it was before. Inside
column4: you discover a miniature version of the discs! No doubt
column5: an item of this sort would be invaluable for someone interested in the ancient history of Azeroth. The Explorers' League in Ironforge is such a group
column6: known throughout the Alliance; perhaps they can make good use of it.

column1: The Platinum Discs^47^Horde^Thunder Bluff^The Discs of Norgannon^Sage Truthseeker^^The Platinum Discs^The Platinum Discs^Take the miniature version of the Discs of Norgannon to the one of the sages in Thunder Bluff.^Touching the Discs of Norgannon once again makes your hand tingle. This time
column2: however
column3: a strange grinding noise is heard from inside the discs. Your backpack suddenly becomes heavier than it was before. Inside
column4: you discover a miniature version of the discs! No doubt
column5: an item of this sort would be invaluable for someone interested in the ancient history of Azeroth. The sages of Thunder Bluff are such historians
column6: known throughout the Horde; perhaps they can make good use of it.

column1: Redridge Rendezvous^16^Alliance^Rogue^Renzik "The Shiv"^Lucius^SI:7^^^Venture forth to Lakeshire in the Redridge Mountains and speak with Lucius.^Sending you out in the field now would be suicide. Renzik doesn't need another dead rogue on his hands. Don't fret
column2: though
column3: <name> - Renzik is going to get you up to speed. Make your way to the Redridge Mountains and speak with an associate of SI:7 named Lucius. You will find him hanging around the docks of Lakeshire with the other shady good-for-nothings.

column1: Alther's Mill^20^Alliance^Rogue^Lucius^Lucius^SI:7^^^Open Lucius's Lockbox
column2: recover the Token of Thievery and return it to Lucius in Lakeshire.^We've been training thieves here for years! After all
column3: not every rapscallion is born with the grace and finesse of old Lucius. Up off the road here you'll find Alther's Mill. I got a chest up there with something important inside. Go get it for me! Bring back that token and you'll receive your Certificate of Thievery!

column1: Necklace Recovery^41^All^Orgrimmar^Dran Droffers^Dran Droffers^Necklace Recovery^^^Look for a valuable necklace within the Uldaman dig site and bring it back to Dran Droffers in Orgrimmar. The necklace may be damaged.^We've got work for you
column2: that is if you've got the guts to do it! Deep in the Badlands is the Uldaman dig site. We've heard a tale about some idiot paladin who died there recently. Why we even care is that he had a very valuable necklace on him. It's supposedly got three large gems: a ruby
column3: a sapphire
column4: and a topaz. The shot: we want it
column5: and we're payin' TOP SILVER to get it. It may be damaged
column6: but that's neither here nor there; we'll fix whatever scratches are on it.

column1: Necklace Recovery
column2: Take 2^41^All^Orgrimmar^Dran Droffers^Remains of a Paladin^Necklace Recovery^^^Find a clue as to the gems' whereabouts in the depths of Uldaman.^As sure as Malton is a dummy
column3: those gems are still in Uldaman somewhere. You're going to have to go back there and look for them. Like I said before
column4: if the information we have is correct then there's a ruby
column5: a sapphire
column6: and a topaz that go with the necklace. Find them and put them in the necklace. As to where the gems are
column7: who knows? Maybe you'll get lucky and find the corpse of the Paladin. If he's not been stripped clean already
column8: then maybe he's got them on him still.

column1: Kingly Shakedown^16^Alliance^Rogue^Hulfdan Blackbeard^Renzik "The Shiv"^To Hulfdan!^^^Travel to Stormwind and seek out Renzik "The Shiv."^So there we were
column2: about to start plottin' out phase III when a couple o' Magni's blockheads come bargin' in here talkin' bout some kind o' heist and arresting some o' the Hidden Circle. Well nobody puts the iron on old Blackbeard! The argumentations got heavy and thick and somehow yer name weres blurted out! Me advice? Take the first Gryphon out o' Ironforge and get to Stormwind. Get yerself to Old Town and once there
column3: talk to an old friend o' mine named Renzik "The Shiv."

column1: To Hulfdan!^16^Alliance^Rogue^Hogral Bakkan^Hulfdan Blackbeard^To Hulfdan!^^Erion's Behest^Travel to Ironforge and speak with Hulfdan Blackbeard.^Where have you been
column2: <name>? Hulfdan's been looking all over the place for you. We thought the king may have put you in irons. Get to Ironforge as soon as possible and speak with Hulfdan!

column1: SI:7^16^Alliance^Rogue^Keryn Sylvius^Renzik "The Shiv"^SI:7^^Erion's Behest^Travel to Stormwind and seek out Renzik "The Shiv."^Renzik was looking for you
column2: fish. I wouldn't keep Mathias's second in command waiting if I were you.

column1: Translating the Journal^42^All^Badlands^Remains of a Paladin^Jarkal Mossmeld^Necklace Recovery^^^Find someone who can translate the paladin's journal. The closest location that might have someone is Kargath
column2: in the Badlands.^At an impasse of sorts
column3: you know that you will need the book translated into a language you can understand. There certainly are a number of people in the world who could do it; the closest location that might have someone who could
column4: however
column5: is the Kargath outpost in the Badlands. Perhaps that is a good place to start.

column1: Translating the Journal^42^All^Badlands^Jarkal Mossmeld^Jarkal Mossmeld^Necklace Recovery^^Find the Gems and Power Source^Let Jarkal borrow the necklace. In exchange
column2: he will translate the journal for you.^Droffers and Son Salvage aren't smart enough to restore the magic in the necklace
column3: but I am. All I want to do is study the necklace so I can learn to make them myself. To do that
column4: I will need your necklace. Let me borrow it
column5: and in exchange for the time I get to study it I will translate the journal for you. While you are searching for the gems
column6: I should have enough time to learn what I need to. It's a simple deal
column7: and no one else will be the wiser. Whatcha wanna do?

column1: Find the Gems and Power Source^44^Horde^Badlands^Jarkal Mossmeld^Jarkal Mossmeld^^Translating the Journal^Deliver the Gems^Recover all three gems and a power source for the necklace from Uldaman
column2: and then bring them to Jarkal Mossmeld in Kargath. Jarkal believes a power source might be found on the strongest construct present in Uldaman.^Here is the journal
column3: translated for you to read on your own. The crux of it says dwarves hid the ruby
column4: the troggs hid the topaz
column5: and a trogg named Grimlok has the sapphire. Look - you're going to need a power source to make the necklace work again. Dran Droffers doesn't know this. To find one
column6: here's what I'd do: go as deep as you can in Uldaman and kill whatever construct there is the strongest. No doubt whatever that is would have it. When you have everything collected
column7: come back here!

column1: Deliver the Gems^44^Horde^Orgrimmar^Jarkal Mossmeld^Dran Droffers^Deliver the Gems^Find the Gems and Power Source^^Deliver the Necklace and Gem Salvage to Dran Droffers in Orgrimmar.^Any necklace setting and gem will work
column2: so long as they are the same material. This power source
column3: however
column4: is what will bring the magic back to the necklace... I hope. I'll gladly supply the gems needed for your version of the necklace
column5: so long as the power source actually works. Head to Orgrimmar and keep your end of the bargain with Droffers and Son Salvage. Just keep your mouth shut about our deal
column6: and when you get back I might have a wonderful surprise for you.

column1: Necklace Recovery
column2: Take 3^44^Horde^Badlands^Dran Droffers^Jarkal Mossmeld^Deliver the Gems^^^Visit Jarkal Mossmeld in Kargath to see if he was successful.^As Dran and Malton Droffers begin to squabble over their new salvage
column3: half of the deal is now complete. A trip to the Badlands is now in order to finish things up
column4: as Jarkal Mossmeld in Kargath might have a special reward waiting for you there.

column1: Reclaimed Treasures^43^Horde^Undercity^Patrick Garrett^Patrick Garrett^^^^Get Patrick Garrett's family treasure from their family chest in the South Common Hall of Uldaman
column2: and bring it to him in the Undercity.^Sweeping the bat pens with this broom is not befitting a Garrett! I've earned a little coin from this accursed job
column3: and I'm willing to spend it on you to better my station. The Garrett family weapon of choice is locked away in our chest in the South Common Hall of Uldaman from when we Garretts toiled there as diggers. Without it
column4: I will be stuck here forever - literally - sweeping up after these infernal bats. Reclaim my family's treasure and bring it to me! Help me restore my birthright!

column1: Horns of Nez'ra^22^All^Rogue^Arantir^Arantir^^^^Return the Horns of Nez'ra to Arantir in Lakeshire.^Many years ago
column2: the Horns of Nez'ra were stolen from Ravenholdt manor. Across continents and oceans I have searched
column3: only to discover that these insignificant beasts have had it in their possession all along. Slay every Blackrock orc you cross until the Horns of Nez'ra are recovered. Should you recover the horns
column4: find me in Lakeshire. Do this for me and your name shall be known to Ravenholdt
column5: <name>.

column1: Klaven's Tower^20^Alliance^Rogue^Agent Kearnen^Master Mathias Shaw^Mathias and the Defias^^^Steal the Defias Tower Key
column2: break into the Defias Tower and uncover the contents of the Duskwood Chest. Take whatever information you find back to Mathias Shaw in Stormwind. Read Kearnen's Journal to gain insight about the tower.^I've been staking out this tower for weeks
column3: <name>. Recently a major shipment came through from Duskwood
column4: and along with it came those guards. What are they? Your guess is as good as mine. I can tell you one thing - they aren't human. Anyhow
column5: the shipment had a chest - which is what I assume those abominations are guarding. The zombie with the spikes holds a key we'll need. Get that key
column6: get in the tower
column7: and uncover whatever is in that chest. Take your findings back to Mathias.

column1: Mathias and the Defias^20^Alliance^Rogue^Master Mathias Shaw^Agent Kearnen^Mathias and the Defias^^^Travel to Westfall and find Agent Kearnen for your debriefing.^Not a moment too soon
column2: <name>. SI:7 reconnaissance is reporting unusually heavy Defias activity in Westfall. It would seem that the Defias have taken over an abandoned Alliance watch tower southeast of Sentinel Hill and are using it as a base of operations to smuggle in goods from the Redridge supply route. Get to Westfall and contact Agent Kearnen for your debriefing. You will find her hidden near the tower. ...and <name>
column3: should you be discovered
column4: SI:7 will disavow all knowledge of your existence.

column1: Find the Shattered Hand^16^Horde^Rogue^Mennet Carkad^Shenthul^Find the Shattered Hand^^^Journey to Orgrimmar and speak with Shenthul at the Cleft of Shadow.^You have served the Deathstalkers well
column2: <name>
column3: but perhaps it is time for you to venture outward. While you have shown aptitude in the ways of stealth and deception
column4: you still require much training. The Deathstalkers have allies within the Shattered Hand. Seek out those that would assist us - find Shenthul in Orgrimmar.

column1: Zando'zan^16^Horde^Rogue^Shenthul^Zando'zan^Find the Shattered Hand^^Wrenix of Ratchet^Speak with Zando'zan at the Cleft of Shadow.^Your determination alone is not enough to overcome the obstacles that lay ahead of us. Speak with Zando'zan to begin your training as an operative of the Shattered Hand. It is only when you have mastered the practices of stealth and thievery that you may take the next step towards your destiny.
To Orgrimmar!^16^Horde^Rogue^Kaplak^Shenthul^To Orgrimmar!^^^Speak with Shenthul at the Cleft of Shadow in Orgrimmar.^A master of stealth and deception you are not
column2: however
column3: all of that can and will change. You've obviously impressed those in charge with your meager skills
column4: as the great Shenthul has asked for you by name. Take the road north of here to Orgrimmar and speak with Shenthul in the Cleft of Shadow.

column1: Plundering the Plunderers^18^Horde^Rogue^Wrenix the Wretched^Wrenix the Wretched^Find the Shattered Hand^^^Bring the Southsea Treasure back to Wrenix the Wretched in Ratchet. Do not forget to get an E.C.A.C. and Thieves' Tools from Wrenix's Gizmotronic Apparatus. You will need both of these items to complete your mission.^I don't mean to scare you
column2: <name>
column3: but the last five thieves I sent to steal the southsea treasure came back to me in pieces. South along the coast you'll find Tide Razor
column4: the southsea freebooter's ship. Nestled in the hold is the payoff - the southsea treasure. On the second level of that ship is the pirate's den
column5: a place where they train all of their thieves. Board that ship
column6: steal the treasure
column7: and bring it back to me. Use the pirate's den if you need to practice your thievery
column8: but be careful!

column1: Wrenix of Ratchet^16^Horde^Rogue^Zando'zan^Wrenix the Wretched^Find the Shattered Hand^^^Travel to Ratchet in the Barrens and speak with Wrenix the Wretched.^Zando'zan has seen it! Yes
column2: the day comes! Thrall's death... the dagger in his back
column3: poison seeping through to his every vein... Zando'zan has said too much. <name>! Zando'zan has a task for <name>! <name> must travel to Ratchet
column4: east of the Crossroads
column5: and speak with Wrenix the Wretched. Go!

column1: Simple Parchment^1^Orc^Warrior^Gornek^Frang^^Cutting Teeth^^Read the Simple Parchment and speak to Frang in the Valley of Trials.^Ah
column2: while you were gone a parchment came for you
column3: <name>. Read it when you have time. If I'm not mistaken
column4: it came from the warrior trainer Frang. He would have words with you when you're ready. You'll find him outside the Den
column5: taking cover in the shade.

column1: The Lost Dwarves^40^Alliance^^Prospector Stormpike^Baelog^The Lost Dwarves^^^Find Baelog in Uldaman.^The dig site at Uldaman wasn't always overrun. We Ironforge dwarves used to control the area
column2: but... that was before the troggs came. They came so fast and in such numbers that not even dwarven might could stop them! In fact
column3: their attack was so sudden that I fear some of our people may be trapped behind enemy lines. My friend Baelog led a small band of dwarves deep within the site just before the troggs showed up. If he and his company live
column4: then I want you to find them.

column1: Power Stones^36^All^Badlands^Rigglefuzz^Rigglefuzz^^^^Bring 8 Dentrium Power Stones and 8 An'Alleum Power Stones to Rigglefuzz in the Badlands.^A while ago
column2: I had an incident with the Shadowforge Dwarves. They brought me to Angor Fortress to study two types of strange stones from Uldaman. I discovered that the stones were sustained
column3: stable power sources if treated correctly. It's amazing the things one can find in that old dig site! Anyway
column4: after I told them the secret of the stones they kicked me out of Angor Fortress and began digging for more in Uldaman. I want those stones for myself! Bring me both types and I'll pay you plenty!

column1: The Emerald Dreamcatcher^6^All^Teldrassil^Tallonkai Swiftroot^Tallonkai Swiftroot^The Emerald Dreamcatcher^^^Bring the Emerald Dreamcatcher to Tallonkai Swiftroot in Dolanaar.^I was once given an emerald dreamcatcher from Gaerolas Talvethen
column2: the warden of the druids in the Ban'ethil Barrow Den. This powerful amulet is able to siphon energy from the Emerald Dream
column3: bestowing luck upon those who carry it. Sadly
column4: I have not been able to retrieve it from my dresser in Starbreeze Village... Although Starbreeze was once a tranquil place
column5: it has now succumbed to the corruption of the furbolg that reside there. Perhaps you would be willing to recover my dreamcatcher
column6: <class>?

column1: The Platinum Discs^47^Alliance^Ironforge^High Explorer Magellas^Dinita Stonemantle^The Platinum Discs^^Portents of Uldum^Take your reward voucher to Dinita Stonemantle in the Vault of Ironforge.^This object is an incredible find. The ancient Titans
column2: or the Creators as these discs refer to them as
column3: are the link to our enchanted creation
column4: if the lore stored in here is correct! We'll need to invest as much research time into this as possible. As for you
column5: heroic <class>
column6: take this voucher to Dinita Stonemantle at the vault. It grants you what I think is a fitting for such a tremendous find! Return to me directly when you are ready; there is much more to do for the Explorers' League!

column1: The Platinum Discs^47^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Sage Truthseeker^Bena Winterhoof^^The Platinum Discs^Portents of Uldum^Take the reward voucher to Bena Winterhoof in Thunder Bluff.^I shall focus my energies on these discs; they will reveal their true workings to me in due time. As for you <name>
column2: I will now reward you for your diligence in bringing this to my attention. Take this voucher to Bena Winterhoof
column3: the alchemy trainer for Thunder Bluff. She will give you a special item I believe you will find appealing
column4: and she will supply you with a choice of potions from my personal stock. Return to me soon
column5: as I sense there is much more at hand for us to do regarding this find.

column1: Deep Cover^20^Horde^Rogue^Shenthul^Taskmaster Fizzule^Rogues of the Shattered Hand^^Mission: Possible But Not Probable^Travel to the Venture Co. Tower
column2: north of the Sludge Fen and contact the Shattered Hand's covert operative
column3: Taskmaster Fizzule.^The Venture Company... Perhaps you have heard of them? For one year we have worked on planting an agent deep within their ranks. Through much hard work and careful planning
column4: we succeeded. Recently we received word that the Venture Co. are planning something on a grand scale. Go north of the Sludge Fen to the Venture Co. tower and contact our undercover agent
column5: Taskmaster Fizzule. When you find the tower
column6: use this flare gun
column7: then approach Fizzule and show him the salute of the Shattered Hand.

column1: Ferocitas the Dream Eater^8^All^Teldrassil^Tallonkai Swiftroot^Tallonkai Swiftroot^The Emerald Dreamcatcher^^^Tallonkai Swiftroot in Dolanaar wants you to kill 7 Gnarlpine Mystics and find the Missing Jewel.^The emerald... It is missing! My dreamcatcher has been damaged! There is a band of Gnarlpine mystics located to the north of Starbreeze. I have heard reports that their leader
column2: Ferocitas the Dream Eater has been wearing a necklace that glows green in the night. Now seeing my dreamcatcher
column3: I am sure that he has stolen my emerald... He would never realize that its power is useless to him. Find this missing jewel
column4: <name>. And
column5: while you're there
column6: clear out some of the corrupted mystics as well.

column1: The Shattered Salute^20^Horde^Rogue^Shenthul^Shenthul^Rogues of the Shattered Hand^^^Perform the Shattered Salute on Shenthul.^As a rogue of the Shattered Hand
column2: it is imperative that you learn the Shattered Salute. It is the only way to truly identify another member of the Hand. Watch
column3: learn
column4: repeat.

column1: Mission: Possible But Not Probable^20^Horde^Rogue^Taskmaster Fizzule^Shenthul^Mission: Possible But Not Probable^Deep Cover^^Steal Silixiz's Tower Key from Foreman Silixiz
column2: then kill two Mutated Venture Co. Drones
column3: two Venture Co. Patrollers
column4: and two Venture Co. Lookouts.^You will need to steal the tower key from Foreman Silixiz
column5: <name>. Once you've got the key in your possession
column6: hold on to it - I may need it later. Remember
column7: the poison has weakened everything in this tower. Use your abilities to bring chaos and destruction to its inhabitants. Slay them all -- show no mercy! Once everything inside lays in a bloodied heap
column8: pick Gallywix's lockbox and steal the cache of Zanzil's mixture held inside. Take both the head of Gallywix and the mixture to Shenthul in Orgrimmar.

column1: Hinott's Assistance^20^Horde^Rogue^Shenthul^Serge Hinott^Mission: Possible But Not Probable^^^Travel to Tarren Mill in Hillsbrad Foothills and deliver the Sample of Zanzil's Mixture to Serge Hinott.^Take a sample of the mixture to Serge Hinott in Tarren Mill. If anyone can cure you
column2: it's Serge. Live long enough and Serge will show you the ways of poison creation and use.

column1: Hinott's Assistance^20^Horde^Rogue^Serge Hinott^Serge Hinott^Mission: Possible But Not Probable^^^Wait for Serge Hinott to complete the cure.^I have never seen such wondrous results from a poison! Zanzil you say? Never heard of him
column2: however
column3: I must commend him on the creation of this concoction. So
column4: I am to cure you of this and then teach you how to make use of the poison? Give me a few moments to examine the toxin
column5: <name>.

column1: Return to Denalan^9^All^Teldrassil^Rellian Greenspyre^Denalan^Return to Denalan^Tumors^^Rellian Greenspyre wants you to speak with Denalan at Lake Al'Ameth.^I have just received word that Denalan at Lake Al'Ameth has discovered what may be the cause of the tumors that plague the timberlings. Please speak with him
column2: and tell him I sent you. Make haste
column3: <name>; he needs our help.

column1: Oakenscowl^9^All^Teldrassil^Denalan^Denalan^Return to Denalan^^^Denalan at Lake Al'Ameth wants you to collect the Gargantuan Tumor from Oakenscowl.^In a cave along the southern bank of the lake
column2: a timberling named Oakenscowl is spreading corruption to all the creatures that make Lake Al'Ameth their home. I dared not get too close
column3: but even from a distance
column4: it is obvious: Oakenscowl is being poisoned by the largest tumor I have ever seen... I would call it gargantuan
column5: even. <name>
column6: you have already done much to aid my efforts
column7: but I ask of you one more task. Hunt down Oakenscowl and collect the tumor; remove this source of corruption from my home.

column1: Badlands Reagent Run^39^Alliance^Loch Modan^Ghak Healtouch^Ghak Healtouch^^^Uldaman Reagent Run
column2: Badlands Reagent Run II^Acquire the reagents Ghak Healtouch needs from the Badlands
column3: then return to him in Thelsamar.^<class>
column4: I would make use of your services. I am an alchemist of some note
column5: and I seek your aid in acquiring some reagents found out in the Badlands. I need the following items to replenish my stocks: five buzzard gizzards
column6: ten crag coyote fangs
column7: and five rock elemental shards. Obviously
column8: you can get them off of the beasties themselves; if you're not the fighting type
column9: then find friends who are. Acquire these items for me
column10: you'll get some coin out of the deal. Well
column11: what say ye?

column1: Badlands Reagent Run II^44^Alliance^Loch Modan^Ghak Healtouch^Ghak Healtouch^^Badlands Reagent Run^^Use the empty thaumaturgy vessels on scorched guardian dragons found in the Badlands. Once you have them filled
column2: bring them to Ghak Healtouch in Thelsamar.^You have been most helpful to me
column3: <name>. I would like to reward you with the very recipe for the brew I gave you earlier
column4: but I must ask of you a favor that is quite dangerous. This lockbox contains three empty thaumaturgy vessels; they are imbued with an attunement aura that will drain the blood of a scorched guardian dragon. Using one on the beast will anger it greatly
column5: so be careful. Once you have all three filled
column6: bring them to me. Do this
column7: and the recipe will be yours.

column1: Tears of the Moon^12^Alliance^Darnassus^Priestess A'moora^Priestess A'moora^The Temple of the Moon^^^Priestess A'moora in the Temple of the Moon at Darnassus wants you to bring her Lady Sathrah's Silvery Spinnerets.^Lady Sathrah was once beloved of Elune. Graceful and pure
column2: the spider spun her silver threads through the moonlight
column3: catching the evening mist. The silvery dew had strong healing powers and was kept here in the temple. But of late
column4: Sathrah has descended into madness. Her future generations are now threatened as well. Find Lady Sathrah
column5: <name>
column6: and end her suffering. She dwells along the northern borders of Teldrassil
column7: near Wellspring Lake. Gather her silvery spinnerets and bring them back to me.

column1: The Temple of the Moon^10^Alliance^Darnassus^Sister Aquinne^Priestess A'moora^The Temple of the Moon^^^Sister Aquinne wants you to speak with Priestess A'moora in the Temple of the Moon.^A once great creature of the forest is in need of help
column2: <race>. There is a difficult task that must be done. Please seek out Priestess A'moora; she will explain things to you. Find her to the southeast of here
column3: inside the Temple of the Moon.

column1: Sathrah's Sacrifice^12^Alliance^Darnassus^Priestess A'moora^Priestess A'moora^The Temple of the Moon^^^Priestess A'moora wants you to place Lady Sathrah's silvery spinnerets at the fountain inside the temple
column2: and then return to her.^Now you must finish the task to which you have been appointed. Take the spinnerets and offer Lady Sathrah's sacrifice to Elune; lay the great spider to rest. Inside this temple
column3: find the central fountain. There is where you may leave the sacrifice. The holy waters will purify and cleanse the corruption that drove Sathrah mad. When you have completed this
column4: return to me.

column1: To Serve Kum'isha^55^All^Blasted Lands^Kum'isha the Collector^Kum'isha the Collector^^^Kum'isha's Endeavors^In your journeys throughout the Blasted Lands
column2: should you ever come across a Flawless Draenethyst Sphere
column3: take the item back to Kum'isha the Collector.^<race>
column4: can your miniscule brain comprehend the rarity of a flawless sphere of draenethyst? Draenei have spent lifetimes in search of just one of these crystals
column5: only to meet horrible fates
column6: their purpose unfulfilled. So you stand before Kum'isha
column7: knowing what Kum'isha has requested and still wish to assist? Very well
column8: <race>... At any time during your travels across these lands
column9: should you find a flawless sphere of draenethyst
column10: return it to me and I shall reward you with riches beyond your wildest dreams.

column1: Kum'isha's Endeavors^55^All^Blasted Lands^Kum'isha the Collector^Kum'isha the Collector^^To Serve Kum'isha^^Find and return a Flawless Draenethyst Sphere to Kum'isha the Collector.^Even though the portal conjuration was a failure

column3: <race>. Go back out into these cursed lands and recover another flawless draenethyst sphere. Of course
column4: the choice to take on this task is completely left to you *grin*.

column1: The Sleeping Druid^8^All^Teldrassil^Oben Rageclaw^Oben Rageclaw^The Sleeping Druid^^^Bring a Shaman Voodoo Charm to Oben Rageclaw in the Ban'ethil Barrow Den.^The Gnarlpine shaman that inhabit this place have discovered a way of separating a sleeping druid's spirit from the physical body. The furbolg have animated my physical form and are using it to attack anyone that attempts to explore the Ban'ethil Barrow Den. I am now trapped in the Emerald Dream
column2: powerless to stop this. You must help me. The Gnarlpine shaman carry a strange charm which is used to perform this ritual
column3: and I'd like to examine it. Please
column4: <name>
column5: bring one to me.

column3: <name>
column4: I see now what must be done. Please take it
column5: and do as I ask. You are to explore the deepest areas of the Ban'ethil Barrow Den. There
column6: you will find my soulless body... Although I regret what I am about to tell you
column7: I see no other way to free myself from the control of the Gnarlpine. In order for me to escape them
column8: you must kill my physical form. Once that is done
column9: use the voodoo charm on my fallen body. After you have completed this task
column10: please return to me.

column1: Snickerfang Jowls^50^All^Blasted Lands^Bloodmage Drazial^Bloodmage Drazial^^^Rage of Ages^Bring three Snickerfang Jowls
column2: two Blasted Boar Lungs
column3: and one Scorpok Pincer to Bloodmage Drazial.^It is a well known fact that hyenas possess tremendous strength in their jowls

column5: improbable
column6: and yet I have seen this demonstrated with my own eyes. Venture forth
column7: into the Blasted Lands
column8: and bring me three snickerfang jowls. As you search for the snickerfang
column9: be on the lookout for boars and scorpoks: The initial assay also requires two blasted boar lungs and one scorpok pincer to complete.

column6: operational imbue

column8: while the immediate effect is a titanic burst of strength
column9: the long term effects on your spirit and intelligence could be hazardous. With that said
column10: do you require more? If so
column11: bring me another three snickerfang jowls
column12: two blasted boar lungs
column13: and one scorpok pincer.

column2: two Scorpok Pincers
column3: and one Basilisk Brain to Bloodmage Drazial.^Within these blasted lands exists two species of boar: the ash-mane boar and the helboar. It would appear that the stamina of these beasts renders them nearly immune to harm
column4: as the other animals find them too difficult to kill and consequently
column5: not worth the effort. We need to perform further analysis
column6: <name>. Should you bring me three blasted boar lungs
column7: two scorpok pincers
column8: and one basilisk brain
column9: I shall create a divine elixir from the residue of the assay. You will be my first test subject!

column1: Spirit of the Boar^50^All^Blasted Lands^Bloodmage Drazial^Bloodmage Drazial^^A Boar's Vitality^^Bring three Blasted Boar Lungs
column2: two Scorpok Pincers
column3: and one Basilisk Brain to Bloodmage Drazial.^When I first administered the elixir
column4: <name>
column5: I could tell that one or two applications would not satiate your appetite. Even now
column6: I can see the hunger in your eyes. The concoction has addictive properties of which
column7: seemingly
column8: the most strong of will cannot resist. So be it! Should you require more of the lung juice cocktail
column9: venture back into the wasteland and find for me three blasted boar lungs
column10: two scorpok pincers
column11: and one basilisk brain.

column2: two Vulture Gizzards
column3: and one Blasted Boar Lung to Bloodmage Drazial.^Have you ever watched them in battle
column4: <name>? The scorpoks
column5: I mean. Have you ever seen the grace and agility with which they move? The decisiveness of their strikes? If only we could somehow isolate that agility and encapsulate it
column6: we would be wealthy beyond our... I mean... it would be a boon for the scientific community. Assist me
column7: <name>
column8: and I shall allow you a sampling of the assay. In order to create a stable sample
column9: I will need three scorpok pincers
column10: two vulture gizzards
column11: and one blasted boar lung.

column5: <name>
column6: back to the wasteland with you and do not return until you have collected three scorpok pincers

column8: and one blasted boar lung.

column1: The Basilisk's Bite^50^All^Blasted Lands^Bloodmage Lynnore^Bloodmage Lynnore^^^Infallible Mind^Bring ten Basilisk Brains and two Vulture Gizzards to Bloodmage Lynnore.^These wastelands are riddled with redstone basilisk
column2: <name>. These basilisk have adapted and flourished
column3: more so than any of the other wildlife within the region. I have watched from afar as they hunt and go about their daily activities - the beasts exhibit a thought process more complex than even some humanoids. I must study their brains! Retrieve ten of their brains for me
column4: <name>. The compound cannot be complete
column5: however
column6: without two vulture gizzards to form the base of the solution.

column1: Infallible Mind^50^All^Blasted Lands^Bloodmage Lynnore^Bloodmage Lynnore^^The Basilisk's Bite^^Bring ten Basilisk Brains and two Vulture Gizzards to Bloodmage Lynnore.^Your focused concentration has dwindled so soon? More research must be done! Oh yes
column2: the price remains the same
column3: <name>. Venture forth into the blasted lands and return to me with ten brains from the redstone and two vulture gizzards.

column1: Vulture's Vigor^50^All^Blasted Lands^Bloodmage Lynnore^Bloodmage Lynnore^^^Spiritual Domination^Bring ten Vulture Gizzards and two Snickerfang Jowls to Bloodmage Lynnore.^Death does indeed have wings in these blasted lands
column2: <race>. I have witnessed the black slayers and bonepickers feasting upon the corpse of many a fallen explorer - sometimes feeding upon the most vile and disease ridden of carcasses. It is a wonder
column3: then
column4: how their internal systems overcome the pestilence that claims these lands. Assist me in my studies
column5: <name>! Gizzards I need! Two snickerfang jowls will also be required for the base of the concoction. You shall be rewarded two-fold for your efforts.

column1: Spiritual Domination^50^All^Blasted Lands^Bloodmage Lynnore^Bloodmage Lynnore^^Vulture's Vigor^^Bring ten Vulture Gizzards and two Snickerfang Jowls to Bloodmage Lynnore.^I see that the inner fire has dwindled. Would you say the spiritual euphoria lasted an hour? If it's more of the gizzard gum you desire
column2: then more of the gizzards I require. Back to the wastelands
column3: <name>. Do not return until you have recovered ten gizzards and two jowls.

column1: The Thirsty Goblin^49^All^Tanaris^Marin Noggenfogger^Marin Noggenfogger^The Thirsty Goblin^^^Collect a Laden Dew Gland and bring it to Marin Noggenfogger in Gadgetzan.^I've got an idea
column2: see. I've heard of some strange creatures called dew collectors that live to the southwest... and that they are able to store water in special glands. I think that if I could get one of these glands
column3: I could create a drink that would quench my terrible thirst! Do you think you could help me
column4: <name>? Look for the cactus garden
column5: <name>; that's where you'll find the dew collectors.

column1: In Good Taste^49^All^Tanaris^Marin Noggenfogger^Sprinkle^The Thirsty Goblin^^^Marin Noggenfogger wants you to speak with Sprinkle in Gadgetzan.^Blech! This stuff tastes terrible! So much for that idea... Wait
column2: what's that? Oh
column3: I know
column4: I know
column5: you think I shouldn't give up on this stuff. Well
column6: okay then. Uhhhh
column7: I have an idea! Brilliant! Take this dew to my friend Sprinkle -- she's an excellent chef. Tell her what we're up to here and that we want to make it go down a little easier. I mean
column8: if it's going to taste that bad
column9: it at least should have some kick to it... And I'm just not feeling it...

column1: The Touch of Zanzil^20^Alliance^Rogue^Master Mathias Shaw^Doc Mixilpixil^Mathias and the Defias^^The Touch of Zanzil^Speak with Doc Mixilpixil in the cellar of the Barracks.^It appears as if you've brought back more information than even I expected. This certainly is a strange turn of events

column3: you look worse than death. You
column4: <sir/miss>
column5: would be what death coughed up at his last physical. Hah! You hear that Noarm? Write that one down! *Cough* Hrm yes
column6: in order for me to help you
column7: I'll need to draw some blood. Don't worry
column8: it only hurts the first few... fifty times or so... /lay down when you're ready for the treatment
column9: <name>.

column3: one Bronze Tube
column4: and one Spool of Light Chartreuse Silk Thread. The 'itis' doesn't cure itself
column5: young <fella/lady>.^It's unanimous

column8: one leaded vial
column9: one bronze tube
column10: and last but certainly not least
column11: one spool of light chartreuse silk thread. Ol' Emma left a spool of it for me at 'The Finest Thread.' You can find the shop along the canals. Hurry along now
column12: <name>
column13: and try not to touch anyone until you're cured. Oh
column14: and Dr. Montgomery says you need a shower -- his words

column1: The Disgraced One^50^Horde^Blasted Lands^Fallen Hero of the Horde^Dispatch Commander Ruag^Fall From Grace^^^Speak to Dispatch Commander Ruag at Stonard in Swamp of Sorrows.^Regret. It is all I have now. One bad decision resulting in several horrible outcomes. If only I had waited for those orders. Maybe they would have detailed the horrors that awaited us in those cursed lands! Maybe they were to redirect us to another detail? Ultimately
column2: it was my fault. All of it was my fault. So here I stand
column3: awaiting orders. I must know. I must have those orders. Dispatch Commander Ruag resides in Stonard. Find him and find out what became of the orders.

column1: The Missing Orders^50^Horde^Swamp of Sorrows^Dispatch Commander Ruag^Bengor^Fall From Grace^^^Speak to Bengor at Stonard in Swamp of Sorrows.^The orders? What could you possibly want with the orders? What are you implying
column2: <name>? Of course I relayed those orders! The soldiers I sent the orders with were ambushed and brutally beaten by murlocs. Only one survived
column3: if you can call that surviving. He can hardly speak
column4: cannot walk
column5: and must be fed through a tube. If you want to know what happened to those orders
column6: speak with Bengor. I'm sure he is around here somewhere... and
column7: <name>
column8: be mindful of what you stick your nose into - it may get bitten off.

column1: The Swamp Talker^55^Horde^Swamp of Sorrows^Bengor^Fallen Hero of the Horde^Fall From Grace^^A Tale of Sorrow^Retrieve the Warchief's Orders and return them to the Fallen Hero of the Horde.^Orders were given by the dispatch commander. We took... took orders. On way to Blasted Lands
column2: ambushed. Murlocs... Many murlocs... One named Swamp Talker. Took orders from my hands as spear thrust into my skull. East... cave.... <Bengor passes out.>

column1: Sprinkle's Secret Ingredient^49^All^Tanaris^Sprinkle^Sprinkle^The Thirsty Goblin^^Delivery for Marin^Sprinkle in Gadgetzan wants you to collect a Violet Tragan and return it to her.^When I was a kid
column2: my sister used to do all the cooking. It was horrible! I could barely stomach some of her concoctions -- until I found what I like to call my "secret" ingredient! Add it to anything
column3: and... WOW! It tastes great! What is it
column4: you ask? It's a mushroom called the Violet Tragan. If you want me to help you turn this horrid-tasting brew into something edible
column5: head to the Hinterlands
column6: and look for a small lake there. Oh
column7: and remember
column8: the Violet Tragan can only be found underwater.

column1: Delivery for Marin^49^All^Tanaris^Sprinkle^Marin Noggenfogger^Delivery for Marin^Sprinkle's Secret Ingredient^^Sprinkle wants to you take the Violet Powder to Marin Noggenfogger in Gadgetzan.^Here's the Violet Powder
column2: <name>. Take it to Marin and tell him he owes me a favor!

column2: to mix this powder in with the dew. Come back and talk to me in a minute... after I have perfected the fabulous Noggenfogger Elixir!

Gather a suitable group of adventurers and free my men of their eternal torture! Eighteen stones you must shatter. Fight hard and die with honor

column3: <name>. One of my men is still unaccounted for
column4: lost somewhere in the Blasted Lands. I am talking about Lieutenant Kirith
column5: of course. As I had mentioned earlier
column6: we were both imprisoned and tortured by Allistarj
column7: but poor Kirith
column8: his strength of will faltered. I could hear the experiments from my cage; the tortured screams rang through the halls of the cave. That was the last I saw or heard of Kirith.

column4: but Rin'ji begs! Must get out of here! Got something for nice <race> if <he helps Rin'ji out of here/she helps Rin'ji out of here>... Rin'ji is hiding something secret at the Overlook Cliffs.

column1: The Cover of Darkness^60^All^Blasted Lands^Spirit of Kirith^Fallen Hero of the Horde^Kirith^^^Return to the Fallen Hero of the Horde with your findings.^Let us not mince words
column2: <race>; my time here is limited. You must destroy the triad of power which protects the demon lord
column3: Razelikh. Doing so will not be as simple a task as freeing a damned soul. <Kirith grins.> You see
column4: each of Razelikh's underlings wears a third of an amulet of Razelikh's creation around their neck. The very same amulet you will need in order to summon the arch demon. Return to Trebor and tell him what is required to summon Razelikh. He will be able to instruct you further.

column1: The Demon Hunter^60^All^Blasted Lands^Fallen Hero of the Horde^Loramus Thalipedes^Kirith^^^Speak with Loramus Thalipedes in Azshara.^The triad is protected by Razelikh. In exchange for their servitude
column2: Razelikh granted each of them nearly unlimited power within the Blasted Lands. The amulet pieces are each attuned to the lifeforce of their owner
column3: granting them immortality. As long as they remain within the Blasted Lands
column4: they cannot be slain
column5: their life spans extended until the end of days. There is one who may be able to assist you further
column6: <name>. Travel to Azshara and find the demon hunter
column7: Loramus Thalipedes. Search the islands.

column1: Infiltrating the Castle^31^Alliance^Stormwind City^Elling Trias^Tyrion^The Unsent Letter^^^Speak to Tyrion in Stormwind Castle.^Hmm
column2: an interesting tale
column3: and not one to be taken lightly. Yeah
column4: I can help you
column5: but what you need to do is divvy out a form of justice that's not... legal
column6: if you're to see this through to the end. Lescovar and Marzon need to be dealt with
column7: and swiftly. Do you think you're capable of such a thing? You decide. If so
column8: then make haste to the castle and find an old friend of mine
column9: a gnome named Tyrion. He's been watching Lescovar now for a couple weeks. He should be able to help you end this.

column1: Items of Some Consequence^31^Alliance^Stormwind City^Tyrion^Tyrion^The Unsent Letter^^The Attack!^Bring 3 Silk Cloth and 2 of Clara's Fresh Apples to Tyrion in Stormwind.^Trias wants the timetable pushed up some
column2: huh? Okay
column3: we can do that
column4: but I'm not ready. And know this
column5: I'm doing the hard part
column6: but you're the one that's going to get <his/her> hands dirty
column7: understand? Good. Okay
column8: I'll need you to get me a few things before I can put my plan into effect. I got the perfect disguise that'll get Spybot past those guards. Bring me some silk and a couple apples. The silk's up to you
column9: but Clara's little farm right outside the city has the perfect sized apples.

column1: Barbaric Battlements^32^Horde^Blacksmithing^Orokk Omosh^Orokk Omosh^^^On Iron Pauldrons^Bring two Patterned Bronze Bracers
column2: two Bronze Greatswords
column3: and two Sharp Claws to Orokk Omosh in Orgrimmar.^Twenty generations of Omosh have held this hammer
column4: <name>. A hundred thousand tons of metal we have molded. Tragically
column5: it all ends at Orokk
column6: failure of the Omosh: Without kin and incapable of producing offspring. I cannot let the secret recipes of Omosh die with me! Someone must continue the legacy
column7: Omosh or not! Prove to Orokk you are capable
column8: <name>. Bring for Orokk the following: Two patterned bronze bracers
column9: two bronze greatswords
column10: and two sharp claws. Bring them for Orokk and we shall continue.

column1: On Iron Pauldrons^32^Horde^Blacksmithing^Orokk Omosh^Orokk Omosh^^Barbaric Battlements^Trampled Under Foot^Bring four Bronze Battleaxes and four Bronze Warhammers to Orokk Omosh in Orgrimmar.^Orokk sees the eagerness in your eyes
column2: <name>. Like a sponge you soak in the wisdom of the Omosh. Three lessons I shall teach! Return to the anvil
column3: soak in the heat of the forge
column4: create for Orokk four bronze battleaxes and four bronze warhammers. Only then will you learn of the iron pauldron.

column1: Trampled Under Foot^36^Horde^Blacksmithing^Orokk Omosh^Orokk Omosh^^On Iron Pauldrons^Horns of Frenzy^Bring four Green Iron Helms
column2: four Green Iron Bracers
column3: and two Green Iron Leggings to Orokk Omosh in Orgrimmar.^Only two more lessons Orokk will teach
column4: <name>. Your muscles ache
column5: I know
column6: but continue on for the Omosh! Bring to Orokk four green iron helms
column7: four green iron bracers
column8: and two green iron leggings - for this you learn and your enemies suffer!

column1: Horns of Frenzy^36^Horde^Blacksmithing^Orokk Omosh^Orokk Omosh^^Trampled Under Foot^Joys of Omosh^Bring two Solid Iron Mauls
column2: two Silvered Bronze Boots
column3: and two Silvered Bronze Gauntlets to Orokk Omosh in Orgrimmar.^The final lesson Orokk teaches you
column4: <name>. To the sacred anvil and forge you return! Bring for Orokk two solid iron mauls
column5: two silvered bronze boots
column6: and two silvered bronze gauntlets. See the fear in their eyes as you approach!

column1: Joys of Omosh^36^Horde^Blacksmithing^Orokk Omosh^Orokk Omosh^^Horns of Frenzy^^Watch and learn the Omosh Dance of Joy.^Orokk is not crying
column2: <name>. Soot is in eye. <Orokk wipes a tear away.> There is one last Omosh family secret Orokk will teach you. Orokk will die happy
column3: thanks to <name>. Learn Omosh dance of joy and then you learn fist of iron!

column1: The Old Ways^40^Horde^Blacksmithing^Aturk the Anvil^Aturk the Anvil^^^Booty Bay or Bust!^Bring four Steel Breastplates and four Steel Plate Helms to Aturk the Anvil in Orgrimmar.^In the time of legends
column2: Aturk would crush the skulls of his enemies and grind the bone into a fine powder for use in filament. Long gone are those days
column3: <race>. The Warchief calls for peace among the clans. Old enemies are now only watched with weary eyes! Unbelievable
column4: I know
column5: but such is the will of Thrall. Enough lamenting! You are here to learn
column6: and learn you will! Bring me four steel breastplates and four steel helms and you will gain a taste of war!

column1: Booty Bay or Bust!^40^Horde^Blacksmithing^Ox^McGavan^Booty Bay or Bust!^The Old Ways^The Mithril Order^Speak with McGavan in Booty Bay.^Listen
column2: kid
column3: you're not gonna learn anything hanging around here. I know a guy who knows a guy. He hangs around the smithy in Booty Bay. If you show him this insignia
column4: he'll tell you all about mithril. So whadd'ya say? Leave this kid stuff to the babies in diapers
column5: <name> -- it's time to move on. If you're interested
column6: his name's McGavan. Show him this trinket and he'll recognize your commitment.

column1: The Origins of Smithing^40^Alliance^Blacksmithing^Hank the Hammer^Hank the Hammer^The Origins of Smithing^^^Bring six Golden Scale Bracers to Hank the Hammer in Stormwind.^When I was about your age
column2: a dwarf by the name of Galvan took me under his wing and trained me in the ways of the armorsmith. Before he left for Booty Bay
column3: he made me promise to train all those with the desire and determination to advance in the craft of blacksmithing -- so here I am -- all these years later. So
column4: now it's time for you to learn a little something. Make me six golden scale bracers and you will learn where smithing comes from
column5: <name>.

column1: In Search of Galvan^40^Alliance^Blacksmithing^Hank the Hammer^McGavan^The Origins of Smithing^^The Mithril Order^Speak with McGavan in Booty Bay.^Although Galvan left Booty Bay many years ago
column2: members of the order still remain in town
column3: hoping to one day find another worthy of Galvan's tutelage. Take this insignia and present it to McGavan in Booty Bay. If you actually make it that far
column4: he'll know that you are worthy. I have faith
column5: <name>!

column1: The Mithril Order^40^All^Blacksmithing^McGavan^Galvan the Ancient^Booty Bay or Bust!^^Smelt On
column2: Smelt Off
column3: The Great Silver Deceiver
column4: The Art of the Imbue
column5: A Good Head On Your Shoulders
column6: The World At Your Feet
column7: The Mithril Kid^Speak with Galvan the Ancient in Stranglethorn Vale.^Most of our recruits never make it to Booty Bay
column8: <name>. The shine of the insignia is enough to trigger the loot lust in even the staunchest of blacksmiths. Fools they be
column9: as the insignia is a drop in the bucket compared to the wealth of items you'll see! Find Galvan the Ancient and show him this pin. His residence is far to the north
column10: between Zul Gurub and the Mosh'Ogg ogre mound.

column1: Smelt On
column2: Smelt Off^45^All^Blacksmithing^Galvan the Ancient^Galvan the Ancient^^The Mithril Order^Galvan's Finest Pupil
column3: Expert Blacksmith!^Bring forty Mithril Bars and forty Iron Bars to Galvan the Ancient in Stranglethorn.^Many blacksmiths believe that mining and smithing are separate
column4: independent jobs; but can there be blacksmithing without mining? Ah ha -- it is an impossibility! The accomplished blacksmith must also be an accomplished miner. Show Galvan that you are capable
column5: <name>. Bring me forty bars of iron and forty bars of mithril. For this
column6: Galvan will teach you the ways of the ornate mithril pants!

column1: The Great Silver Deceiver^45^All^Blacksmithing^Galvan the Ancient^Galvan the Ancient^^The Mithril Order^Expert Blacksmith!^Bring forty Mithril Bars and five Truesilver Bars to Galvan the Ancient in Stranglethorn.^It is said that truesilver is stronger and more durable than mithril. Galvan does not disagree with this assessment of the minerals
column2: but contrary to its name
column3: truesilver is not true! Mithril is a far nobler mineral! HAH! Regardless
column4: for this lesson you will need to find the great silver deceiver
column5: <name>. Bring me forty bars of mithril and five bars of truesilver. In exchange
column6: you will be taught the secret of ornate mithril gloves and more importantly
column7: learn that truesilver is a liar!

column1: The Art of the Imbue^45^All^Blacksmithing^Galvan the Ancient^Galvan the Ancient^^The Mithril Order^Expert Blacksmith!^Bring forty Mithril Bars and four Citrines to Galvan the Ancient in Stranglethorn.^The harvesting of precious gems is of utmost importance to our craft
column2: <name>. Few gems are more precious than the citrine. The magical properties we imbue into our goods are amplified greatly by the presence of citrine. For this lesson
column3: we will fortify forty bars of mithril with four citrines. The result will be a better understanding of magical gemology and the knowledge to create ornate mithril shoulders.

column1: Galvan's Finest Pupil^45^All^Blacksmithing^Galvan the Ancient^Trenton Lighthammer^^Smelt On
column2: Smelt Off^^Speak with Trenton Lighthammer at Gadgetzan in Tanaris.^If you are ready to conclude your training with Galvan
column3: you should journey to Gadgetzan. There
column4: you will find my finest pupil: Trenton Lighthammer. He has much to teach you in the ways of ornate mithril. Otherwise
column5: remain here and learn! Oh
column6: Gadgetzan is in Tanaris
column7: of course!

column1: Expert Blacksmith!^45^All^Blacksmithing^Galvan the Ancient^Galvan the Ancient^^Smelt On
column2: Smelt Off
column3: The Great Silver Deceiver
column4: The Art of the Imbue^^Claim your reward from Galvan the Ancient!^When you first came to me
column5: I knew that you would turn out to be one of my finest pupils! It was without hesitancy that you gave up a trinket of some power to McGavan. You did this only so that you could meet me. Such blind faith and devotion to the craft should be rewarded. You have attained expertise over blacksmithing
column6: <name>. Reap the rewards!

column1: Find OOX-22/FE!^45^All^Feralas^OOX-22/FE Distress Beacon^Homing Robot OOX-22/FE^Find OOX-22/FE!^^^Take the distress beacon to Oglethorpe's homing robot in a cave near Feral Scar Vale.^You have uncovered some sort of strange
column2: egg-shaped device made from metal. Fiddling with one of its knobs springs the egg to life
column3: as it opens up into some sort of gnomish robotic contraption! A voice from inside the robotic egg crackles to life. "My name's Oglethorpe Obnoticus
column4: and my homing robot has crashed! I will reward you for its recovery; please take this beacon to the robot!" "I now have computed the coordinates of the robot for you; it is in a cave near Feral Scar Vale!"

column1: Rescue OOX-22/FE!^45^All^Feralas^Homing Robot OOX-22/FE^Oglethorpe Obnoticus^Find OOX-22/FE!^^An OOX of Your Own^Escort OOX-22/FE to safety
column2: then report to Oglethorpe Obnoticus in Booty Bay.^The gnome's voice crackles once again from the robot: "I need to move OOX-22/FE to an open
column3: safe place so it can begin a lengthy take-off procedure. It has built-in cloaking
column4: but I need time on my end to make it operational again. Escort the robot from its current location to
column5: let's say
column6: the main road! That should be a perfect place
column7: and long enough
column8: to get things online!" "Escort it safely and then come talk to me in Booty Bay! Oglethorpe Obnoticus - out!"

column1: Divino-matic Rod^47^All^Tanaris^Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle^Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle^^^^Bring the Divino-matic Rod to Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle in Gadgetzan.^Sergeant Bly stole from me! He said he'd only borrow it
column2: but he stole my cherished divino-matic rod!! Without that rod how will I know where to dig new water holes?? Find Bly and bring me my rod! I heard he led his band of ill-reputed adventurers to go treasure hunting in Zul'Farrak to the west. I bet you'll find him there. Let's hope the trolls took care of him
column3: because if you have to fight him for the rod then you're in for a serious fight.

column1: The Brassbolts Brothers^46^Alliance^Thousand Needles^Klockmort Spannerspan^Wizzle Brassbolts^The Brassbolts Brothers^^^Speak with Wizzle Brassbolts in the Shimmering Flats.^Have you met the Brassbolts brothers? They're over in the Shimmering Flats
column2: in Kalimdor
column3: racing their rocket car against the goblins. They usually win which is no surprise--the goblin car blows up so much it barely ever crosses the finish line! But even then
column4: the Brassbolts brothers are always looking for new ways to make their car go faster
column5: and Wizzle told me he needs a very rare component for his next experiment. He probably needs help getting that part. Speak to him and find out.

column1: Gahz'rilla^50^All^Thousand Needles^Wizzle Brassbolts^Wizzle Brassbolts^The Brassbolts Brothers^^^Bring Gahz'rilla's Electrified Scale to Wizzle Brassbolts in the Shimmering Flats.^Deep in Zul'Farrak
column2: the sand troll city in Tanaris
column3: there is a sacred pool. From that pool the trolls summon a huge beast! Gahz'rilla! He's so fierce that even his scales crackle with energy. It's that energy I want to harness for my car! Bring me the electrified scale of Gahz'rilla! But the summoning of Gahz'rilla is a well-kept secret of the trolls. To face him
column4: you must first wrest the secret from them.

column1: A Good Head On Your Shoulders^45^All^Blacksmithing^Trenton Lighthammer^Trenton Lighthammer^^The Mithril Order^Did You Lose This?^Bring two Mithril Coifs and one Ornate Mithril Shoulder to Trenton Lighthammer.^It seems as if master had this planned from the start. I was not taught to create the items which you learned to create and you were not taught the items which I learned to create. The master is wise
column2: <name>. We shall teach each other! Show me how to make a mithril coif and ornate mithril shoulders and I shall show you how to create an ornate mithril helm.

column1: The World At Your Feet^45^All^Blacksmithing^Trenton Lighthammer^Trenton Lighthammer^^The Mithril Order^Did You Lose This?^Bring two Heavy Mithril Boots and one Ornate Mithril Pants to Trenton Lighthammer.^At last year's All-Valley Blacksmithing Championship
column2: all those who watched saw my leg get swept from under me by a cowardly dog from the Venture Co. Foundry. What they didn't know
column3: however
column4: was the reason I was able to continue and ultimately win the tournament: That's right
column5: ornate mithril boots! I will need to learn how to craft ornate mithril pants for this year's tournament
column6: however
column7: as a Venture Co. shredder is an entrant! Teach me the way of the pants and learn the way of the boot!

column1: The Mithril Kid^45^All^Blacksmithing^Trenton Lighthammer^Trenton Lighthammer^^The Mithril Order^Did You Lose This?^Bring two Heavy Mithril Breastplates and one Ornate Mithril Gloves to Trenton Lighthammer.^Around these parts I am known as the Mithril Kid. I supply ornate mithril to adventurers from around the world. <Trenton whispers.> Little do they know that I do not know the technique to fashion ornate mithril gloves. Shhhh! This will be our little secret. Teach me the technique to create ornate mithril gloves
column2: <name>
column3: and in exchange
column4: I will show you the resultant of the culmination of my training under Galvan: the ornate mithril breastplate.

column1: WANTED: Caliph Scorpidsting^46^All^Tanaris^Wanted Poster^Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle^^^^Bring the head of Caliph Scorpidsting to Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle in Gadgetzan.^WANTED: Caliph Scorpidsting! The Gadgetzan Water Company of Gadgetzan
column2: Tanaris will pay a high bounty for the head of Caliph Scorpidsting
column3: leader of the Wastewander outlaws. His crimes include: 1. Murdering Gadgetzan Water Co. employees!2.Stealing Gadgetzan Water Co. resources!3.Seizing Gadgetzan Water Co. property! Bring proof of Caliph Scorpidsting's demise to Chief Engineer Bilgewhizzle for an immediate reward!

column1: Rin'ji's Secret^47^Horde^The Hinterlands^Rin'ji's Secret^Oran Snakewrithe^Rin'ji is Trapped!^^Oran's Gratitude^Oran Snakewrithe
column2: a well known scholar on matters concerning the Witherbark trolls
column3: may be able to decipher the tablet. She is known to reside within the Magic Quarter of the Undercity.^The tablet is covered with Witherbark troll markings. Rin'ji's secret truly is a mystery... It's possible that you might have something quite valuable on your hands here. On the other hand
column4: quite the opposite is also possible. A Witherbark troll in distress would probably do anything to find his way out of trouble...

column1: Petty Squabbles^57^Alliance^Blasted Lands^Ambassador Ardalan^Fallen Hero of the Horde^Petty Squabbles^^A Tale of Sorrow^Speak with the Fallen Hero of the Horde at the border of the Blasted Lands and the swamp.^We fight the wrong enemy
column2: <name>. The true power in these lands continues to grow in strength and number while we squabble over scorched earth with orcs. Do we continue to fight a war in these lands against the Horde
column3: only to be routed one day by the armies of the Burning Legion? It is futile. Put your differences aside
column4: <name>
column5: speak with the fallen hero of the Horde. He knows the truth behind the Blasted Lands.

column1: Fall From Grace^50^Horde^Blasted Lands^Fallen Hero of the Horde^Fallen Hero of the Horde^Fall From Grace^^^Listen to the Fallen Hero of the Horde tell his story.^Hear my story
column2: <race>.

column1: A Tale of Sorrow^57^All^Blasted Lands^Fallen Hero of the Horde^Fallen Hero of the Horde^Petty Squabbles^^^Listen to the Fallen Hero of the Horde tell his story.^Before we may continue
column2: you must hear my story.

column1: The Mark of Quality^46^Alliance^Feralas^Pratt McGrubben^Pratt McGrubben^^^Improved Quality^Bring 10 Thick Yeti Hides to Pratt McGrubben in Feathermoon Stronghold.^My philosophy on leatherworking is that the work must be the best quality possible - no compromises. Anyone who says that quality doesn't matter is trying to sell you ocean-front property in Dun Morogh! In my latest pursuit of high-quality materials
column2: I have run across thick yeti hides. The Yeti are native to Feralas
column3: with many found in Feral Scar Vale. I want some
column4: and I'll give you a choice of one of my leather goods for a stack of ten. If that sounds fair to you
column5: then we're in business.

column1: The Mark of Quality^46^Horde^Feralas^Jangdor Swiftstrider^Jangdor Swiftstrider^^^Improved Quality^Bring 10 Thick Yeti Hides to Jangdor Swiftstrider in Camp Mojache.^I take pride in my leather work
column2: and I feel it shows; quality should never be compromised. Anyone who says that quality doesn't matter would also have you believe that the earth does not keep secrets! In my latest pursuit of high-quality materials
column3: I have discovered thick yeti hides. Yetis are native to Feralas
column4: often found west of here in Feral Scar Vale. I'll give you a choice of one of my leather goods for a stack of ten. If that is agreeable to you
column5: then we are set!

column1: Rig Wars^35^Horde^Orgrimmar^Nogg^Nogg^^^^Retrieve the Rig Blueprints and Thermaplugg's Safe Combination from Gnomeregan and bring them to Nogg in Orgrimmar.^Gnome technology - two years ago its most common use was as a punch line. Times certainly have changed. Now they've got a new rig built that's better than all our shredder models combined. I need the blueprints
column2: <name>! Unfortunately
column3: the plans are locked away in a safe near Mekgineer Thermaplugg. To make matters worse
column4: the combination to the safe is only known by Mekgineer Thermaplugg. Do whatever you have to do to get that combination
column5: <name>. Then crack open that safe and bring back those blueprints!

column1: Chief Engineer Scooty^35^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Sovik^Scooty^Chief Engineer Scooty^^^Speak with Scooty in Booty Bay.^As soon as we got word from Kernobee about the new gnomish rig
column2: Scooty and I began work on the Transpolyporter 6000: The fastest and most reliable way to Gnomeregan. It's finally ready for passengers to board
column3: <name>. If you want to give it a try
column4: go to Booty Bay and talk with Scooty at the wind rider roost. To get to Booty Bay
column5: take the boat from Ratchet. Of course
column6: you could always try and make the run to Gnomeregan through the dwarf infested mountains of Dun Morogh!

column1: Gnomer-gooooone!^35^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Scooty^Scooty^Chief Engineer Scooty^^^Wait for Scooty to calibrate the Goblin Transponder.^As long as you have the transponder in your possession
column2: all you need to do is step on the pad and you'll be teleported to Gnomeregan. You may experience some unusual side effects
column3: but none of those should be permanent... anymore. I almost forgot the most important part - getting back. When you're ready to come back
column4: just step on the transpolyporter pad in Gnomeregan! Now to calibrate the transponder to your size and weight.

column1: The Giant Guardian^49^Alliance^Feralas^Rockbiter^Shay Leafrunner^The Giant Guardian^^^Locate the lost night elf girl.^I am no good
column2: <name>. I was 'spose to be watchin' over my little friend
column3: Shay
column4: and somehow
column5: she got away from me. I'm not all that sure what happened
column6: really
column7: but last time I saw her
column8: we was walkin' through the ruins just north of here. Everythin' was goin' fine
column9: but then I turned around
column10: and... she was gone. Now I jus can't quite figure out what I should do here. Got any ideas
column11: <name>? I'm awful worried. Hey
column12: how 'bout you go look fer Shay? Yer legs can travel much faster 'n mine.

column1: Wandering Shay^49^Alliance^Feralas^Shay Leafrunner^Rockbiter^The Giant Guardian^^^Pick up Shay's Bell from the chest.^Do you think you could help me find my way back to my friend
column2: Rockbiter? He was supposed to be watching me... But I do have a tendency to wander off now and then. There are just so many things to see
column3: and I get so distracted. There is one thing that will always work to get my attention
column4: though. Inside this chest
column5: you'll find a bell that is very precious to me. I just love the sound of it. You have my word
column6: if I wander off
column7: all you have to do is ring it and I'll come running back.

column1: Tiara of the Deep^46^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Tabetha^Tabetha^Tabetha's Task^^^Bring the Tiara of the Deep to Tabetha in Dustwallow Marsh.^Long ago I possessed a beautiful piece of jewelry
column2: the Tiara of the Deep. And not only was it pretty--it held great power for those with the knowledge to use it. So when word of the tiara reached the Hydromancer Velratha
column3: she had to have it. She sent agents to my home and they stole it while I was away. The thieves! I want my tiara back! Go to Zul'Farrak
column4: the troll city in Tanaris
column5: find Velratha and wrench the tiara from her. Return it to me and you'll earn my favor.

column1: Wild Leather Armor^45^Alliance^Leatherworking^Pratt McGrubben^Pratt McGrubben^^^Wild Leather Shoulders
column2: Wild Leather Vest
column3: Wild Leather Helmet
column4: Wild Leather Boots
column5: Wild Leather Leggings
column6: The Alliance Needs Silk Bandages!^Bring 10 Thick Leather to Pratt McGrubben in Feathermoon Stronghold.^<name>
column7: you're becoming quite skilled as a leatherworker! I know some patterns you might be interested in... Wild Leather armor! Wild Leather taps into the potent and chaotic properties of wildvines
column8: found in areas of lush vegetation and on some of the creatures there. The armor made using it is second to none for people of your skill
column9: guaranteed. I'll teach this to you
column10: but you'll be working for me for a while. The first cost is simply ten pieces of thick leather. After this
column11: we'll talk specifics.

column1: Wild Leather Shoulders^45^Alliance^Leatherworking^Pratt McGrubben^Pratt McGrubben^^Wild Leather Armor^Master of the Wild Leather^Bring 6 Thick Armor Kits and a Wildvine to Pratt McGrubben in Feathermoon Stronghold.^Wild Leather shoulders support the wearer's frame extremely well
column2: offering top notch protection of the upper arms and the shoulders themselves. As with all Wild Leather armor
column3: a potent but random benefit is applied to the item as the wildvine is stitched in. For this pattern
column4: I will require six thick armor kits and a wildvine. That shouldn't be too tall of an order for you to fill.

column1: Wild Leather Vest^45^Alliance^Leatherworking^Pratt McGrubben^Pratt McGrubben^^Wild Leather Armor^Master of the Wild Leather^Bring 2 Turtle Scale Breastplates
column2: 2 Turtle Scale Gloves
column3: and a Wildvine to Pratt McGrubben in Feathermoon Stronghold.^Wild Leather vests are the staple of any Wild Leather armor set. The frame of the vest blends with the wildvine to produce a product that offers maximum protection of the torso while allowing for the potent magic to work its way through the garment. For this pattern
column4: I will require two Turtle Scale breastplates
column5: two sets of Turtle Scale gloves
column6: and a wildvine. It's a tall order
column7: but one you should have little difficulty in filling for me.

column1: Wild Leather Helmet^45^Alliance^Leatherworking^Pratt McGrubben^Pratt McGrubben^^Wild Leather Armor^Master of the Wild Leather^Bring 2 Nightscape Tunics
column2: 2 Nightscape Headbands
column3: and a Wildvine to Pratt McGrubben in Feathermoon Stronghold.^A Wild Leather helmet offers the wearer superior protection to the vital areas of the head without a sacrifice in comfort. As with all Wild Leather armor
column4: the integrated wildvine yields a powerful but random enhancement to the frame of the helm. Leather wearers will definitely want this piece! For this pattern
column5: I will need two Nightscape tunics
column6: two Nightscape headbands
column7: and a wildvine. Complete this order and the pattern will be yours!

column1: Wild Leather Boots^45^Alliance^Leatherworking^Pratt McGrubben^Pratt McGrubben^^Wild Leather Armor^Master of the Wild Leather^Bring 2 Nightscape Pants
column2: 2 Nightscape Boots
column3: and 2 Wildvines to Pratt McGrubben in Feathermoon Stronghold.^You've learned quite a bit now
column4: <name>; still
column5: there is more for you to learn. Next are Wild Leather boots
column6: the cornerstone of any set. These boots are crafted to cradle the foot in comfort while bracing it against the hazards of adventuring. The soft soles are a blessing to those seeking quiet movement in footwear. For this pattern
column7: I need an order of two Nightscape pants and two Nightscape boots filled. I also will require two wildvines... not just one. When you have all this
column8: let me know.

column1: Wild Leather Leggings^45^Alliance^Leatherworking^Pratt McGrubben^Pratt McGrubben^^Wild Leather Armor^Master of the Wild Leather^Bring 2 Turtle Scale Helms
column2: 2 Turtle Scale Bracers
column3: and 2 Wildvines to Pratt McGrubben in Feathermoon Stronghold.^With the basics down
column4: you are ready to master more complex fare
column5: <name>. Wild Leather leggings are some of the sturdiest and powerful leather gear around. The waist
column6: thighs
column7: calves
column8: and the vitals - all are given tremendous protection. Coupled with the enhancement that the wildvine provides
column9: adventurers who own it will thank you each time they see you. For this pattern
column10: I need an order of two Turtle Scale helms
column11: two Turtle Scale bracers
column12: and two wildvines filled.

column2: Wild Leather Vest

column8: and then some... but I cannot give it to you myself. My teacher
column9: the one who brought me into the craft

column11: and let him acknowledge you as an equal
column12: as I do.
