column14: is the one who must reward you. Take this note to Una; she teaches leatherworking in Thunder Bluff. Show her the letter
column15: and let her acknowledge you as an equal

column1: Tabetha's Task^46^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Ursyn Ghull^Tabetha^Tabetha's Task^^^Speak with Tabetha in Dustwallow Marsh.^Rumor is that Tabetha
column2: a mage colleague who lives deep in Dustwallow Marsh
column3: has a bone to pick with a certain sand troll in Zul'Farrak. If you speak with Tabetha she can tell you more. And bring some friends with you
column4: <name>. If Tabetha has you go to Zul'Farrak then you're not going to want to go alone. You will find Tabetha's cottage west of Theramore
column5: and just north of the Stonemaul Ruin.

column1: War on the Woodpaw^42^Horde^Feralas^Hadoken Swiftstrider^Hadoken Swiftstrider^War on the Woodpaw^^^Bring 10 Woodpaw Gnoll Manes to Hadoken Swiftstrider in Camp Mojache.^The gnolls... they are more than a nuisance. They are a constant threat to the existence of this very camp! It is irrelevant whether they are indigenous to Feralas or not; if we do not strengthen our resolve against them
column2: we will find ourselves driven out of the entire region. The gnoll attacks against the camp have become more fevered as of late. We need your aid in thinning their numbers; bring to me ten of their manes
column3: and I will reward you handsomely for your effort. Go!

column1: Alpha Strike^43^Horde^Feralas^Hadoken Swiftstrider^Hadoken Swiftstrider^War on the Woodpaw^^^Kill 5 Woodpaw Alphas and return to Hadoken Swiftstrider within one hour.^The plan is for various leaders of the gnolls - Alphas as they call themselves - to be taken down within rapid succession. If we're able to execute this sort of swift and precise devastation against them
column2: it would cause chaos in their ranks. Perhaps it would also drive a message through their thick flea-bitten heads that we can and will destroy them! I want you to be the messenger of my will; eliminate five of their Alphas within one hour for this to work <name>
column3: or we'll remain at this impasse!

column1: Tran'rek^45^All^Tanaris^Krazek^Tran'rek^Tran'rek^^^Speak with Tran'rek in Gadgetzan.^My cousin Tran'rek is in a tight spot. He promised me a load of scarab shells weeks ago and he hasn't delivered. He's my cousin
column2: so I'd hate to have to send someone to Gadgetzan to break something on him. Can you speak to Tran'rek for me? Let him know he needs to get that delivery together before I do something rash? Gadgetzan is in northern Tanaris
column3: in Kalimdor.

column1: Scarab Shells^45^All^Tanaris^Tran'rek^Tran'rek^Tran'rek^^^Bring 5 Uncracked Scarab Shells to Tran'rek in Gadgetzan.^The scarabs of Tanaris have very hard shells! Hard enough to use as a building material for lots of things. So many things! In fact
column2: those shells are so useful... the scarabs were hunted all to near extinction! I know where there are more scarabs
column3: and if you promise to bring me their shells then I'll tell you where they are. Promise? Ok
column4: the scarabs have a colony in Zul'Farrak. I guess the trolls don't hunt them for their shells. But you can! Go to Zul'Farrak and get me uncracked shells!

column1: The Ruins of Solarsal^43^Alliance^Feralas^Shandris Feathermoon^Solarsal Gazebo^The Ruins of Solarsal^^^Explore the Ruins of Solarsal and investigate the presence of the naga there.^To our south are the Ruins of Solarsal; this is an area that far pre-dates modern times. We explored the ruins initially and found nothing of note; as such
column2: we left it in peace. Very recently
column3: the Hatecrest naga have occupied these ruins in alarming numbers. At first
column4: we considered it as the precursor for an attack. Though that threat is still possible
column5: we believe there might be something else going on. Go there
column6: explore the ruins
column7: and look for anything that stands out to you. Good luck
column8: <name>.

column1: Return to Feathermoon Stronghold^43^Alliance^Feralas^Solarsal Gazebo^Shandris Feathermoon^The Ruins of Solarsal^^Against the Hatecrest^Return to Shandris Feathermoon in the Feathermoon Stronghold and report your findings.^With the discovery of the strange gazebo in the heart of the Ruins of Solarsal
column2: the time has come to return to Feathermoon Stronghold and report to General Shandris Feathermoon what has been discovered here.

column1: Against the Hatecrest^43^Alliance^Feralas^Latronicus Moonspear^Latronicus Moonspear^Against the Hatecrest^^^Bring 10 Hatecrest Naga Scales to Latronicus Moonspear in Feathermoon Stronghold.^The best course of action at this point is to assume that
column2: regardless of what the naga are up to
column3: they will eventually move to secure the island for their own. We need to take aggressive steps to counter that threat before it is too late. Bring me ten Hatecrest Scales that are in good condition; it should be obvious to you how to acquire them. You'll cut your teeth on the naga for the first time
column4: and we'll have a weakened naga presence on Sardor Isle - both are prospects that play to our advantage.

column1: Against Lord Shalzaru^45^Alliance^Feralas^Latronicus Moonspear^Latronicus Moonspear^Against the Hatecrest^^^Eliminate Lord Shalzaru
column2: and then bring the Mysterious Relic he uncovered to Latronicus Moonspear in Feathermoon Stronghold.^<name>
column3: new scouting reports have given us a good idea on the naga chain of command. Royalty is present amongst their rank and file
column4: and they're the ones calling all the shots. Specifically
column5: we've identified one of the crueler royals as Lord Shalzaru. Scouts report that he himself has uncovered an odd relic during a recent naga excavation in a cave south of the main ruins
column6: across the water on the Isle of Dread. Put a stop to it by putting a stop to him
column7: and bring me his relic so we can study it.

column1: Delivering the Relic^45^Alliance^Feralas^Latronicus Moonspear^Vestia Moonspear^Against the Hatecrest^^^Deliver the Mysterious Relic to Vestia Moonspear in Feathermoon Stronghold.^If you would be so kind as to deliver the relic to my wife Vestia
column2: I would appreciate it. She's not only a fine priestess for our community
column3: but she is one of the most well-versed scholars you'll find anywhere. I couldn't make heads or tails of this device even if there was a wager involved. My wife though
column4: if anyone can figure out what this thing is
column5: she could... and we need to know! She's just around the bend
column6: no doubt studying. Thanks
column7: <name>.

column1: Stoley's Debt^45^All^Tanaris^"Sea Wolf" MacKinley^Stoley^Stoley's Debt^^^Speak with Stoley in Steamwheedle Port.^My old buddy Stoley owes me a very special bottle of rum. He tends the bar at Steamwheedle Port in Tanaris
column2: Kalimdor
column3: and he promised me that the rum there is stronger than anything we can find in Booty Bay. He's so confident that he says if I try that rum and don't agree with him
column4: then he'll double the money he owes me! Well
column5: I think he's not as confident as he was when last we spoke
column6: and now he's afraid to give me that rum. But I don't back down from wagers
column7: so why don't you talk to him for me...

column1: Stoley's Shipment^45^All^Tanaris^Stoley^Stoley^Stoley's Debt^^^Bring Stoley's Shipment to Stoley in Steamwheedle Port.^I owe "Sea Wolf" MacKinley in Booty Bay some rum
column2: to settle a bet
column3: but I'm all out of rum! Captain Cuergo stole my last shipment
column4: and he has it stowed in that walled pirate town to the south. If you can find my shipment of rum and return it to me
column5: then I can prove to MacKinley that Kalimdor's booze beats the dirt out of Booty Bay!

column1: Deliver to MacKinley^45^All^Tanaris^Stoley^"Sea Wolf" MacKinley^Stoley's Debt^^^Bring Stoley's Bottle to "Sea Wolf" MacKinley in Booty Bay.^Thanks again for your help
column2: <name>. Here's a bottle of Steamwheedle bilge rum. Take it to MacKinley and he can finally put to rest his crazy beliefs about Booty Bay booze.

column1: WANTED: Andre Firebeard^45^All^Tanaris^Wanted Poster^Security Chief Bilgewhizzle^^^^Bring Andre's Head to Security Chief Bilgewhizzle in Steamwheedle Port.^The vile pirate Andre Firebeard is wanted for crimes against Steamwheedle and Gadgetzan. By decree of governing counsel
column2: any who read this are hereby authorized to use lethal force during the apprehension of Andre and his abettors. By further decree
column3: should Andre be deceased
column4: or otherwise indisposed
column5: during the time of his hearing
column6: his head may act as proxy
column7: and deliverance of such head to Security Chief Bilgewhizzle constitutes a binding
column8: and tenderable
column9: contract.

column1: Ship Schedules^45^All^Tanaris^Ship Schedule^Security Chief Bilgewhizzle^^^^Report the Ship Schedules to an authority in Steamwheedle Port.^This scroll contains the schedules of shipments between Steamwheedle Port and Booty Bay. Both past and future shipments are included
column2: along with ship names
column3: with large 'X's next to some ships' journeys
column4: and annotations like "GREAT LOOT" and "HARD FIGHT" next to others. Someone at Steamwheedle Port would want to see this document.

column1: Skulk Rock Clean-up^48^Alliance^The Hinterlands^Fraggar Thundermantle^Fraggar Thundermantle^^^^Kill 10 Green Sludges and 10 Jade Oozes
column2: and then report back to Fraggar Thundermantle in Aerie Peak.^We Wildhammers remember the past
column3: more than our brothers in Ironforge. If you want to make friends here
column4: then you get your hands dirty for us! The Horde abandoned their positions in the Hinterlands around Skulk Rock; it's now overrun with nasty sludges and oozes. We've got plans on that area
column5: but first we need a clean-up crew to make a hole for us. That's where you come in
column6: Sunshine! Head down there and take out ten green sludges and ten jade oozes
column7: then report back to me here. Move out!

column1: The Stave of Equinex^50^Alliance^Feralas^Troyas Moonbreeze^Equinex Monolith^The Stave of Equinex^Return to Troyas^^Energize Troyas' Stave and find the Equinex Monolith.^This stave might be the Stave of Equinex! The Stave of Equinex is actually a key
column2: used to unlock the Equinex Monolith in the Ruins of Ravenwind
column3: on the mainland west of the Dream Bough. Find the four flames that still burn in those ruins: Samha
column4: Imbel
column5: Byltan
column6: and Lahassa. Retrieve their essence and then while standing by the Equinex Monolith
column7: use the essences to energize the stave. If this is truly is the Stave of Equinex
column8: you will be able to unlock the Monolith and gather a sacred artifact from it.

column1: Troll Necklace Bounty^45^All^The Hinterlands^Fraggar Thundermantle^Fraggar Thundermantle^^^^Bring 5 Troll Tribal Necklaces to Fraggar Thundermantle in Aerie Peak.^Get this straight
column2: <race> - we are NOT part of the Alliance! The Wildhammers are independent
column3: relying on deeds and actions to prove one's worth
column4: rather than the blather of those who use jibber-jabber to bolster their do-nothing attitudes! If you're looking for friends here
column5: then prove your worth to us first! The foul trolls that choke the hillsides of the Hinterlands sometimes carry tribal necklaces. Bring five of them to me
column6: and we'll mark it down as a step in the right direction for you.

column1: Cuergo's Gold^45^All^^Cuergo's Treasure Map^Pirate's Treasure!^^^^Find Cuergo's gold!^This map shows a stretch of beach with a southern face. Below the map are words
column2: elegantly written... South of WheedleSouth of homeFind a mast and flag and bonesDig you there
column3: if you be boldDig and claim Cuergo's gold!A key you'll need and a key you'll seeThe men you face take blood as fee.

column1: Woodpaw Investigation^43^Horde^Feralas^Hadoken Swiftstrider^Woodpaw Battle Map^War on the Woodpaw^^^Find the gnoll battle plans somewhere in the gnoll camps to the south of Camp Mojache.^Gnolls aren't the sharpest tools in the shed
column2: but they will no doubt have some sort of documented strategy on their recent activity. If we were to find those plans
column3: then we'd have a clearer idea of what is making them so worked up. I want you to head back to the Woodpaw and find anything that might resemble their battle plans. They have to have something; their attacks have been too coordinated to be done without them. Find them
column4: and return to me when you have them.

column1: The Battle Plans^43^Horde^Feralas^Woodpaw Battle Map^Hadoken Swiftstrider^War on the Woodpaw^^Zukk'ash Infestation
column2: Stinglasher^Bring the Woodpaw Battle Plans to Hadoken Swiftstrider in Camp Mojache.^With the battle plans of the gnolls discovered
column3: all that now remains is to bring the plans back to Hadoken Swiftstrider in Camp Mojache. Perhaps he or someone there can make further sense of what the gnolls are up to.

column1: A Fine Mess^30^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Kernobee^Scooty^^^^Escort Kernobee to the Clockwerk Run exit and then report to Scooty in Booty Bay.^<Kernobee groans.> Wha.. What happened? The last thing I remember is being captured by a group of dark iron dwarves
column2: beaten to within an inch of my life and then thrown in here with these filthy troggs. Get me out of here
column3: <name>! Here's the plan: Lead me to the exit; if we make it out alive
column4: you go to Booty Bay and let Scooty know that I went to Ratchet to warn Tinkerwiz of the dark iron's involvement in the making of that super rig. Let's get going!

column1: Save Techbot's Brain!^26^Alliance^Ironforge^Tinkmaster Overspark^Tinkmaster Overspark^Tinkmaster Overspark^^^Bring Techbot's Memory Core to Tinkmaster Overspark in Ironforge.^When our beloved city Gnomeregan fell
column2: a rogue spark must have jolted my poor creation
column3: Techbot. It once aided me and my associates with its countless gizmos and limitless store of information
column4: but its positronic brain has polarized. Now it's negatronic... and Techbot's behaviors are reversed. It roams Gnomeregan in a frenzy! But perhaps it can be salvaged. Perhaps
column5: if you can retrieve Techbot's memory core and bring it to me
column6: I can discover the cause of the polarization and fix my poor Techbot.

column1: Tinkmaster Overspark^26^Alliance^Ironforge^Brother Sarno^Tinkmaster Overspark^Tinkmaster Overspark^^^Speak with Tinkmaster Overspark in Ironforge.^Tinkmaster Overspark is very upset with the fate of his mechanical creation
column2: Techbot. I remember Techbot as a kind and helpful tool for the gnomes
column3: but Overspark tells me it's malfunctioned. Very sad. But with luck perhaps he can be fixed! Speak with Tinkmaster Overspark
column4: in Tinker Town in Ironforge. He would welcome your help.

column1: Essential Artificials^30^Alliance^Ironforge^Klockmort Spannerspan^Klockmort Spannerspan^Klockmort's Essentials^^^Bring 12 Essential Artificials to Klockmort Spannerspan in Ironforge.^A nigh-universal mechanical component--the essential artificial--was of great use to the tinkers and smiths of Gnomeregan. But during the frantic exodus from our city
column2: no one remembered to take any of these devices with them! And I need a large supply of them for work I will soon undertake. Please
column3: go into Gnomeregan and get me some essential artificials. You'll find them in the deeper areas of our city
column4: held in containers called artificial extrapolators. Thank you
column5: <name>
column6: and please hurry!

column1: Klockmort's Essentials^30^Alliance^Ironforge^Mathiel^Klockmort Spannerspan^Klockmort's Essentials^^^Speak with Klockmort Spannerspan in Ironforge.^A gnome friend
column2: Klockmort Spannerspan
column3: sent word to me from Ironforge. He tells me he needs help on a dangerous
column4: but essential
column5: mission into Gnomeregan
column6: the once great gnome city now contaminated and filled with mad gnomes and their devices. I must stay here
column7: but my heart aches to help my friend. If you can go in my stead
column8: then I would be much indebted to you. You may find Klockmort in Tinkertown
column9: in Ironforge.

column1: Gnogaine^27^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Ozzie Togglevolt^Ozzie Togglevolt^^The Day After^The Only Cure is More Green Glow^Use the Empty Leaden Collection Phial on Irradiated Invaders or Irradiated Pillagers to collect radioactive fallout. Once it is full
column2: take it back to Ozzie Togglevolt in Kharanos.^Since the accident
column3: all Gnoarn thinks about or talks about is cleansing Gnomeregan of the trogg infestation and finding a cure for the sickness that plagues it
column4: <name>. Luckily
column5: Razzle and I are close to some kind of cure - either that or the recipe for a really powerful rum. We won't know until we test! Naturally
column6: in order to test our theory
column7: we're going to need a few things; namely
column8: fallout from the irradiated troggs in Gnomeregan. Fill up this phial with the green glow and bring it back!

column1: The Day After^27^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Gnoarn^Ozzie Togglevolt^^^Gnogaine^Speak with Ozzie Togglevolt at Kharanos in Dun Morogh.^You don't think I was always bald
column2: do you? No <sir/ma'am>! It was the radiation leak in Gnomeregan that caused this tragic hair loss. Before that day
column3: I had the only gnomefro in all of Azeroth. <Gnoarn shakes his fist in the air.> Damn those damned dirty troggs - damn them all!! Perhaps it's not too late
column4: <name>. We may still be able to save it - the city I mean! Speak to Ozzie Togglevolt in Kharanos. He and his partner Razzle are working on a solution.

column1: Gyrodrillmatic Excavationators^30^Alliance^Stormwind City^Shoni the Shilent^Shoni the Shilent^^^^Bring twenty-four Robo-mechanical Guts to Shoni in Stormwind.^It's terrible
column2: <name>. We are not going to have enough parts to get our fleet of gyrodrillmatic excavationators to Dun Morogh. What we need are spare parts
column3: <name>. What better place to get the spare parts for our vehicles than Gnomeregan? I hear that bots and mechs roam around that place like cattle on an open range. What I need you to do is go to Gnomeregan and tear apart those robots. Bring me back their robot guts. Two dozen should be sufficient.

column1: The Grand Betrayal^35^Alliance^Ironforge^High Tinker Mekkatorque^High Tinker Mekkatorque^^^^Venture to Gnomeregan and kill Mekgineer Thermaplugg. Return to High Tinker Mekkatorque when the task is complete.^I trusted Thermaplugg
column2: <race>. Never did I expect that he would betray me and the entire gnomish people. And for what? Power? Wealth? All things that he would have had in time. Now we have been displaced from our home and that madman is in charge. The king of nothing.... We will retake Gnomeregan
column3: <name>. We will not stop until the city is back in our control. If you wish to join in our fight
column4: a simple task I ask of you: Kill the betrayer. Destroy Mekgineer Thermaplugg.

column1: Data Rescue^30^Alliance^Ironforge^Master Mechanic Castpipe^Master Mechanic Castpipe^Castpipe's Task^^^Bring a Prismatic Punch Card to Master Mechanic Castpipe in Ironforge.^When we fled Gnomeregan
column2: we left so much data behind! Vitally important data! I need the data on a prismatic punch card
column3: from a Matrix Punchograph 3005-D high security terminal
column4: deep in Gnomeregan. You must access the terminal
column5: but to do that you first need clearance... and to get that you must access lower security terminals-- models -A
column6: -B and -C. And to do THAT you need security punch cards
column7: starting with white... and we left all the punch cards in the city. It's a catastrophe! Can you help?

column1: Castpipe's Task^28^Alliance^Ironforge^Gaxim Rustfizzle^Master Mechanic Castpipe^Castpipe's Task^^^Speak with Master Mechanic Castpipe in Ironforge.^Master Mechanic Castpipe in Ironforge has need of adventurers! He's organizing bands to reenter Gnomeregan on a data retrieval mission of top security and importance. Castpipe might not be a member of the Enlightened Assembly of Arcanology
column2: Alchemy and Engineering Sciences like I am
column3: but he's still a smart gnome so if he thinks it's important
column4: then by my calculations there's an eighty-four percent probability that it really is important! Those are good odds!

column1: Grim Message^42^All^The Hinterlands^Nimboya^Nimboya^^^^Gather Witherbark Skulls and place on Nimboya's Pike. Place Nimboya's Laden Pike at one of the Witherbark Villages in the Hinterlands
column2: then return to Nimboya in Stranglethorn.^The Witherbark trolls were once allies to the Horde
column3: but they betrayed Thrall... and that must be punished! Here
column4: take my pike and go to the Hinterlands
column5: far to the north. You will find it northeast of Tarren Mill
column6: a village held by our allies
column7: the Forsaken. When you enter the Hinterlands
column8: hunt Witherbark trolls. Gather their skulls and drive my pike into the ground at one of their smaller villages
column9: Hiri'watha or Zun'watha. Show them their vile actions are of consequence!

column1: Venom Bottles^43^Horde^The Hinterlands^Venom Bottle^Apothecary Lydon^Venom Bottles^^^Bring a Venom Bottle to an apothecary in Tarren Mill.^These bottles hold a vile
column2: green venom. Considering the number of bottles in this village
column3: the Witherbarks must deem it very important. Perhaps an apothecary in nearby Tarren Mill would like a sample.

column1: Undamaged Venom Sac^45^Horde^The Hinterlands^Apothecary Lydon^Apothecary Lydon^Venom Bottles^^^Bring an Undamaged Venom Sac to Apothecary Lydon in Tarren Mill.^I must have a fresh sample of the venom you brought me. The spiders from which it was gathered must dwell in the Hinterlands -- hunt them until you find an undamaged venom sac and bring it to me. You will find many spiders near the troll city of Shadra'Alor. Do not tarry
column2: <name>
column3: for the venom sac must be fresh when you deliver it.

column1: Consult Master Gadrin^45^Horde^The Hinterlands^Apothecary Lydon^Master Gadrin^Venom Bottles^^^Speak with Master Gadrin in Sen'jin Village.^The venom from the broodguards wasn't as potent as the venom you brought originally. It must have come from a different spider. I want a fresh sample of that venom. To find out where it came from
column2: you must consult with a troll who knows the Witherbark well--Master Gadrin in Sen'jin Village. Travel to Durotar and speak with Gadrin. With luck
column3: he'll know where the Witherbarks get their venom.

column1: The Spider God^45^Horde^Durotar^Master Gadrin^Master Gadrin^Venom Bottles^^^Read from the Tablet of Theka to learn the name of the Witherbark spider god
column2: then return to Master Gadrin.^The Witherbarks worship a spider god
column3: and from her they collect their most potent venom. So if you want the venom
column4: then you must summon their god! To do that
column5: you must know her true name
column6: and that name is on a tablet buried in Tanaris
column7: in the troll city of Zul'Farrak
column8: in a tomb guarded by Theka the Martyr. Defeat Theka and find and read his tablet to discover the spider god's name. When you know it
column9: return to me.

column1: Summoning Shadra^55^Horde^The Hinterlands^Master Gadrin^Apothecary Lydon^Venom Bottles^^Venom to the Undercity^Defeat Shadra at the altar of Shadra'Alor
column2: then bring her venom to Apothecary Lydon in Tarren Mill.^Take his parchment
column3: and read it at the altar of Shadra'Alor
column4: deep within the witherbark realm in the Hinterlands. This will summon Shadra the spider god.

column1: Venom to the Undercity^55^Horde^The Hinterlands^Apothecary Lydon^Master Apothecary Faranell^^Summoning Shadra^^Bring Faranell's Parcel to Master Apothecary Faranell in the Undercity.^The venom you gathered from the Witherbark's spider god is quite a find! I've been able to kill nearly two dozen rabbits with just a drop of the stuff. Granted
column2: some of those rabbits were very young and small enough to fit in the palm of one's hand so I'm certain their resistance to toxins was low
column3: but it can't be denied that this poison is powerful! I'd like a sample sent to my superior
column4: Apothecary Faranell in the Apothecarium of the Undercity. I am positive he would want to test this himself.

column1: In Search of Knowledge^47^Alliance^Feralas^Troyas Moonbreeze^Daryn Lightwind^^^Feralas: A History^Talk to Daryn Lightwind in Rut'theran Village.^While the ruins of Feralas can be quite dangerous
column2: they have much to tell of what has happened here. Searching through the rubble to the south a few days ago
column3: I discovered what appears to be a normal stave. However
column4: I just can't shake the feeling that there is something more to it. Angelas and I have been poring over our books here
column5: but we can't find a thing about it. I have a colleague in Darnassus that may be able to tell us what this is
column6: <name>. Why don't you go talk to her and see if she can help us?

column1: Feralas: A History^47^Alliance^Feralas^Feralas: A History^Daryn Lightwind^Feralas: A History^In Search of Knowledge^^Ask Daryn Lightwind if you may borrow her book.^This book looks as if no one has opened it for quite a long time. Its covers are quite worn
column2: and its pages yellowed
column3: but after examining it
column4: you notice that it might be just what Troyas is looking for. You pick it up
column5: but realize you should probably ask before borrowing it.

column1: The Borrower^48^Alliance^Feralas^Daryn Lightwind^Curgle Cranklehop^Feralas: A History^^^Take the letter to Curgle Cranklehop in Tanaris.^I have studied many subjects in my time
column2: and my latest fascination is with the snapjaw that occupy the beach in the Hinterlands. There's one in particular I'd like to see
column3: a giant snapjaw named Gammerita. I'd like to go myself
column4: but my research keeps me here. I think a picture of her would be the next best thing. Take this letter to Curgle Cranklehop in Tanaris. She has created an invention for me that can capture a picture. She called it a "snapshot
column5: I think...The Morrow Stone^50^Alliance^Feralas^Equinex Monolith^Troyas Moonbreeze^The Stave of Equinex^^^Return the Sparkling Stone and the Stave of Equinex to Troyas Moonbreeze in Feathermoon Stronghold.^The moment the artifact is removed from the Monolith, you feel the energy in the Stave of Equinex begin to fade.Return to Troyas^48^Alliance^Feralas^Daryn Lightwind^Troyas Moonbreeze^Feralas: A History^^The Stave of Equinex^Deliver the book to Troyas Moonbreeze in Feathermoon Stronghold.^Here it is, <name>. Please, take care of my book. Now, hurry along. I'm sure Troyas is eager for your return.The Super Snapper FX^48^Alliance^Feralas^Curgle Cranklehop^Daryn Lightwind^Feralas: A History^^^Use the Super Snapper FX to take a snapshot of Gammerita, then return to Daryn Lightwind in Rut'theran Village.^Have the first look at my new invention, <name>. All you need to do is target whatever it is you'd like to take a picture of, and push the button. What was that creature from the Hinterlands that you mentioned? Gammerita? Well, good luck finding her. I'm sure Daryn will be quite pleased with the snapshot you return to her. In any case, here's the Super Snapper. Have fun!Grime-Encrusted Ring^34^All^^Grime-Encrusted Ring^The Sparklematic 5200^^^Return of the Ring, Return of the Ring^Figure out a way to remove the grime from the Grime-Encrusted Ring.^You have uncovered what appears to be a ring from the corpse of one of the Dark Iron dwarves. It is difficult to tell what kind of ring it is, however; dirt and hardened residue cake the item completely, making wearing it impossible. You think you can make out the slight luster of precious metal and maybe even the glint of a gem under the residue. If you are going to make use of this ring, you are going to need to find something to get the hardened residue off of it.Seeing What Happens^50^Alliance^Ironforge^Historian Karnik^Uldum Pedestal^Portents of Uldum^^The Stone Watcher^Bring the miniature platinum discs to the gates of Uldum in Tanaris and look for clues as to the connection between the two.^We want you to take the miniature discs you found to the sealed gates of Uldum. We... we aren't sure what will happen when you do this. This sounds risky, sure, we acknowledge that. It might, however, do nothing. You might need to use the discs on something. Perhaps the doors unlock when you have the discs in your possession. Be open to try anything, and be ready for anything to happen. When you've found out what happens, return to Ironforge. We'll have a lot to analyze when you're done!Return of the Ring^34^Alliance^Ironforge^The Sparklematic 5200^Talvash del Kissel^Return of the Ring^Grime-Encrusted Ring^^You may either keep the ring, or you may find the person responsible for the imprint and engravings on the inside of the band.^Opening the box produced by the Sparklematic 5200 reveals what you had suspected - a shiny ring! Wearing the ring, you feel magic power surge through you body. Inside the band is a small but nonetheless discernable imprint of the seal of Ironforge. Next to that, three small initials are engraved: TdK". This may signify either the initials of the previous owner
column6: or perhaps the initials of the ring's crafter. Keep the ring... or return it to this person. Decisions
column7: decisions...

column1: Gnome Improvement^35^Alliance^Ironforge^Talvash del Kissel^Talvash del Kissel^Return of the Ring^^^Bring the Brilliant Gold Ring
column2: a Silver Bar
column3: a Moss Agate
column4: and 30 silver coins to Talvash del Kissel in Ironforge.^Listen <name>
column5: that ring is yours
column6: sure... but I can make you a better one! That design
column7: like I said
column8: is really simple. I am a lot more skilled now
column9: and for the mere fee of thirty silver coins I'll spruce it up for you! Well
column10: a little more than thirty
column11: actually... I'm in a tight spot right now; all my material stock is all dried up. If you bring me a bar of silver and a moss agate
column12: I'll add a silver and agate lattice to the ring that will give it a little more pizzazz! Trust me!

column1: Return of the Ring^34^Horde^Orgrimmar^The Sparklematic 5200^Nogg^Return of the Ring^Grime-Encrusted Ring^^You may either keep the ring
column2: or you may find the person responsible for the imprint and engravings on the inside of the band.^Opening the box produced by the Sparklematic 5200 reveals a shiny ring! Donning the ring
column3: you feel magic power surge through your body. Inside the band is a small but nonetheless discernable imprint of the seal of Orgrimmar. Engraved letters are next to it
column4: but only the first three stand out even after cleaning: "NOG..." This may signify either the initials of the previous owner
column5: or perhaps the initials of the ring's crafter. Keep the ring... or find "NOG" - decisions
column6: decisions...

column1: Nogg's Ring Redo^35^All^Orgrimmar^Nogg^Nogg^Return of the Ring^^^Bring the Brilliant Gold Ring
column2: a Silver Bar
column3: a Moss Agate
column4: and 30 silver coins to Nogg in Orgrimmar.^No
column5: no
column6: no - I'm not all of the sudden saying that the ring is mine. I normally don't do this
column7: but your information about the Dark Irons was very useful. I'll improve your ring for you
column8: better than whomever made this simple little thing could have ever done. Probably some gnome... If you bring me a bar of silver
column9: a moss agate
column10: and thirty silver coins for my trouble
column11: I'll add a silver and agate lattice to the ring that will strengthen the magic inside of it. Interested?

column1: The Sparklematic 5200!^30^All^Dun Morogh^The Sparklematic 5200^The Sparklematic 5200^^^The Sparklematic 5200!^Insert a Grime-Encrusted Item into the Sparklematic 5200
column2: and be sure to have three silver coins to start the machine.^This contraption stands out amongst the gnomes holding out against the madness outside the room. A small plaque on the device reads "The Sparklematic 5200"
column3: followed by some text: "Grime and residue ruining your sparklies? The Sparklematic 5200 puts the shine back in shine-tastic! Insert the item you wish to clean and deposit three silver coins in the coin slot. Give the Sparklematic 5200 a moment for operation
column4: and voila! Your valuables will emerge clean and shiny!"

column1: The Stone Watcher^50^All^Tanaris^Stone Watcher of Norgannon^Uldum Pedestal^^^Return to Thunder Bluff
column2: Return to Ironforge^Learn the purpose of the Stone Watcher of Norgannon
column3: and then interact with the Uldum Pedestal in the Tanaris desert.^"Salutations - I am a guardian of entry. Unless you have the Plates of Uldum already integrated with your disc set
column4: I will not allow for entry into the Uldum compound." The appearance of the Stone Watcher of Norgannon must be the reaction that was hoped for in sending you out to the Tanaris desert with the platinum discs. As instructed
column5: you will need to find out what the story behind the Stone Watcher is before continuing on.

column1: The Only Cure is More Green Glow^30^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Ozzie Togglevolt^Ozzie Togglevolt^^Gnogaine^^Travel to Gnomeregan and bring back High Potency Radioactive Fallout. Be warned
column2: the fallout is unstable and will collapse rather quickly.^Not only was your sample insufficient in quantity
column3: it was also impure. What we require is more green glow. The troggs are obviously not irradiated sufficiently to fulfill our needs. You will have to go into Gnomeregan and bring back some radioactive fallout
column4: straight from the tap. I am speaking of the irradiated slimes
column5: lurkers and horrors. Be warned
column6: the containment of this type of fallout is difficult. You may need to make several attempts with the phial until a suitable sampling is recovered.

column1: Portents of Uldum^50^Alliance^Ironforge^High Explorer Magellas^Historian Karnik^Portents of Uldum^The Platinum Discs^^Speak with Historian Karnik in the Hall of Explorers within Ironforge.^Greetings once again
column2: <name>! Your discovery inside Uldaman has set the Explorers' League abuzz with excitement. The League has been working to unlock the secrets of the miniature platinum discs you found. Your fortuitous arrival here in the Hall allows me to share with you that we are quite possibly on to something! Historian Karnik has uncovered some important clues as to the true origins of the Valley of the Watchers in the Tanaris desert. He would like to speak with you as soon as possible!

column1: A Future Task^50^Alliance^Ironforge^Historian Karnik^High Explorer Magellas^Return to Ironforge^^^Speak with High Explorer Magellas in Ironforge.^Well <name>... we seem to be at a temporary dead end here. We know what we need - the Plates of Uldum - but we have no idea where they might be. We'll need to do quite a bit of research on this to come up with a solid plan of attack. I have a couple ideas where to start looking; I have high hopes that soon
column2: we'll be asking you to head out and recover them. The High Explorer needs to be informed on this
column3: <name>; no doubt
column4: he also wants to thank you personally for once again aiding the League.

column1: Portents of Uldum^50^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Sage Truthseeker^Nara Wildmane^Portents of Uldum^The Platinum Discs^^Speak with Nara Wildmane on the Elder Rise in Thunder Bluff.^Ah
column2: <name>
column3: it is fortuitous that you have come to me again. Your revelations at the Uldaman dig site have certainly given us sages much discuss. I was doing just that with one of the druids
column4: Nara Wildmane
column5: when it dawned on me that her past adventuring experiences may have some great importance as to the next step we need to take. I would like for you to speak with her concerning her travels to the Valley of the Watchers in the Tanaris desert. She waits for you on the Elder Rise.

column1: Seeing What Happens^50^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Nara Wildmane^Uldum Pedestal^Portents of Uldum^^The Stone Watcher^Bring the miniature platinum discs to the gates of Uldum in Tanaris and look for clues as to the connection between the two.^Sage Truthseeker and I would like you to take the miniature discs you found to the sealed gates of Uldum. We... we aren't sure what will happen when you do this. This sounds risky
column2: sure
column3: we acknowledge that. It might
column4: however
column5: do nothing. You might need to use the discs on something. Perhaps the doors unlock when you have the discs in your possession. Be open to try anything
column6: and be ready for anything to happen. Learn what you can
column7: then return to me. We will have much to discuss.

column1: Return to Thunder Bluff^50^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Uldum Pedestal^Nara Wildmane^Return to Thunder Bluff^The Stone Watcher^^Speak with Nara Wildmane in Thunder Bluff.^You access the pedestal again; the platinum discs suddenly appear once more in your backpack. With the knowledge of the stone watcher learned and the discs returned to your possession
column2: the time has come to return to Thunder Bluff and inform the Nara Wildmane of your discovery.

column1: A Future Task^50^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Nara Wildmane^Sage Truthseeker^Return to Thunder Bluff^^^Speak with Sage Truthseeker in Thunder Bluff.^Well <name>... we seem to be at an unfortunate impasse. We know what we need - the Plates of Uldum - but we have no idea where they might be. We will research this
column2: and then devise a solid plan of attack. I have a couple ideas where to start looking; I have high hopes that soon
column3: we'll be asking you to rejoin our efforts to discover the truth. Sage Truthseeker needs to be informed on this
column4: <name>; no doubt
column5: he also wants to thank you personally for once again heeding the call.

column1: Freedom for All Creatures^47^Alliance^Feralas^Kindal Moonweaver^Kindal Moonweaver^^^Doling Justice^Using the Bamboo Cage Key
column2: free the Sprite Darters from the pen in the Grimtotem camp. At least 6 Sprite Darters and Kindal Moonweaver must survive.^The filthy Grimtotem clan are capturing faerie dragons
column3: <name>. Jer'kai and I have no idea what they plan on doing with them
column4: but they're obviously up to no good. We're not powerful enough to fight our way into the camp and free the captured dragons
column5: but perhaps with your help... If you're willing
column6: and you have some strong friends
column7: release the creatures from their cage with this key and make sure they escape with their lives. I'll be by your side the entire time. Jer'kai will remain here.

column1: Doling Justice^47^Alliance^Feralas^Jer'kai Moonweaver^Jer'kai Moonweaver^^Freedom for All Creatures^Doling Justice^Kill 12 Grimtotem Naturalists
column2: 10 Grimtotem Raiders
column3: and 6 Grimtotem Shamans before returning to Jer'kai Moonweaver in Feralas.^As she's already told you
column4: Kindal and I will now take the fight to the Grimtotem. Together
column5: we should still be able to pick off some of the tauren without much threat to ourselves
column6: but we'd love some help if you're willing and able. You've seen the camp below us
column7: but there are more to the east. Using your own tactics
column8: deal as much damage to the tauren as you can. We can all meet back here after they've felt the sting of Kindal's arrows and your own weapons.

column1: Doling Justice^47^Alliance^Feralas^Jer'kai Moonweaver^Tyrande Whisperwind^^Doling Justice^An Orphan Looking For a Home^Take Jer'kai's Signet Ring to High Priestess Tyrande Whisperwind in Darnassus.^Out here in the wilderness
column2: Kindal and I have meager means to reward your help
column3: but we don't want you to feel unappreciated. Take my signet ring. If you ever find yourself in the boughs of Teldrassil
column4: go to the Temple of the Moon in the heart of Darnassus. There you will find my High Priestess Tyrande Whisperwind. The ring will let her know that we are well and give credit to your story. We both thank you
column5: <name>.

column1: A New Cloak's Sheen^45^Horde^Feralas^Krueg Skullsplitter^Krueg Skullsplitter^A New Cloak's Sheen^^^Bring 10 Iridescent Sprite Darter Wings to Krueg Skullsplitter in Camp Mojache.^Well met
column2: <class>. I've traveled with my companions down to the Feralas on a mission for our Orgrimmar masters. My life-mate Korrin finds great pleasure in new clothing
column3: so I aim to make her a new cloak adorned with the gossamer wings of faerie dragons. Would you be able to help me? Sprite darters with gorgeous wings I want are west of Camp Mojache.

column1: A Grim Discovery^45^Horde^Feralas^Krueg Skullsplitter^Krueg Skullsplitter^A New Cloak's Sheen^^^Bring 20 Grimtotem Horns to Krueg Skullsplitter in Camp Mojache.^What!? You came across tauren in the area? You're joking! What did they look like!? The Grimtotem clan! You found some of them? Belgrom
column2: one of our masters
column3: has an interest in their kind... he's even put a bounty on them. You have to go back
column4: <class>. Go back and bring me their horns... piles of them if you can. The Grimtotem are not to be trifled with or underestimated. Go back and slay them; let the rivers in Feralas run red with their dark blood.

column1: The Ogres of Feralas^43^Horde^Feralas^Rok Orhan^Rok Orhan^A Threat in Feralas^^^Rok Orhan in Camp Mojache wants you to kill 10 Gordunni Ogres
column2: 10 Gordunni Ogre-Magi
column3: and 5 Gordunni Brutes.^The effects of the Gordunni Ogre tribe can hardly go unnoticed in this area. Look around
column4: <name>; their very presence scars this land. We must push them back before they expand even further into Feralas. Follow the river north
column5: and you will find their outpost. Decrease their numbers
column6: <name>. We must show them that their kind is not wanted here.

column1: A Grim Discovery^45^Horde^Feralas^Krueg Skullsplitter^Belgrom Rockmaul^A New Cloak's Sheen^^^Bring the Crate of Grimtotem Horns to Belgrom Rockmaul in Orgrimmar.^What?! Ah
column2: so I did mention a bounty
column3: didn't I? Well
column4: that'll teach me to open my mouth
column5: won't it? You did the work
column6: so I suppose it is only right you reap the greatest reward from it. Take the horns
column7: I'll have them put in a crate for you. Find Belgrom Rockmaul in the Valley of Honor
column8: he'll want to know what you saw and he'll reward you for your hard work. Be well
column9: <class>
column10: and thank you again for everything you've done.

column1: Return to Ironforge^50^Alliance^Ironforge^Uldum Pedestal^Historian Karnik^Return to Ironforge^The Stone Watcher^^Speak with Historian Karnik in Ironforge.^You access the pedestal again; the platinum discs suddenly appear once more in your backpack. With the knowledge of the stone watcher learned and the discs returned to your possession
column2: the time has come to return to Ironforge and inform the Explorers' League of your discovery.

column1: The Gordunni Scroll^43^Horde^Feralas^Gordunni Scroll^Rok Orhan^The Gordunni Scroll^^^Bring the Gordunni Scroll to Rok Orhan in Camp Mojache.^Picking up the soiled scroll
column2: you notice that it seems to be depicting some sort of meeting or ceremony. Rok Orhan would be interested in this scroll
column3: and what it might mean to the Gordunni.

column1: Dark Ceremony^46^Horde^Feralas^Rok Orhan^Rok Orhan^The Gordunni Scroll^^^Rok Orhan in Camp Mojache wants you to find a Gordunni Orb.^These seem to be plans for some sort of dark ceremony
column2: <name>. From what I can make out
column3: this ritual is conducted by the Gordunni mage-lords. Find one of these mage-lords
column4: and from him
column5: gather an orb. The orb of a mage contains great power
column6: and will help us discover more about this ceremony and the magic that the Gordunni wield.

column1: The Ogres of Feralas^44^Horde^Feralas^Rok Orhan^Rok Orhan^A Threat in Feralas^^^Rok Orhan in Camp Mojache wants you to kill 10 Gordunni Shaman
column2: 10 Gordunni Warlocks
column3: and 5 Gordunni Maulers.^Now that you have proven that you are a true fighter
column4: I trust that you possess the courage to continue with the task at hand. Travel to the High Wilderness
column5: southwest of here. There lie some abandoned and destroyed structures
column6: on land that once belonged to the night elves. Look for these ruins
column7: and when you see the withered trees and desecrated terrain
column8: you will find the Gordunni. Push them back. These ogres are much stronger than the ones you faced previously
column9: <name>. Be aware.

column1: A Threat in Feralas^43^Horde^Orgrimmar^Belgrom Rockmaul^Rok Orhan^A Threat in Feralas^^^Belgrom Rockmaul wants you to speak with Rok Orhan in Camp Mojache.^Feralas is an ideal location for an accomplished <class> to prove <himself/herself>. A tribe of ogres called the Gordunni are the dominant military force there
column2: and their numbers are growing. They must be stopped before they threaten our presence in Feralas. A warrior I know of named Rok Orhan resides at Camp Mojache in Feralas; go to her. She will tell you more of the situation when you arrive.

column1: The High Wilderness^44^Alliance^Feralas^Angelas Moonbreeze^Angelas Moonbreeze^^^^Angelas Moonbreeze wants you to kill 8 Gordunni Warlocks
column2: 8 Gordunni Shaman
column3: and 8 Gordunni Brutes.^Although it is dangerous
column4: Troyas and I have been investigating the ruins that cover the forests of Feralas. Lately
column5: though
column6: Troyas has been going on his own to the High Wilderness
column7: and I really worry about him. The Gordunni Ogres have taken over that area
column8: and they don't take kindly to anyone that enters their territory. I was hoping you might be willing to travel to the ruins to the southeast and clear out some of the ogres. Make it a little safer for my Troyas
column9: and I will be extremely grateful.

column1: Call of Fire^10^Horde^Shaman^Swart^Kranal Fiss^Call of Fire^^^Find Kranal Fiss in the Barrens.^It's been some time since you were tested last
column2: <name>. You've been patient thus far in your studies
column3: but it's time for you to learn about greater powers... it's time you learn real power. The element of fire is yours if you're prepared to pay for it. Seek out Kranal Fiss in the Barrens. He lives in a small dwelling north of the Crossroads
column4: but be mindful
column5: if you've reached the blasted night elf lands
column6: you've gone way too far.

column1: Call of Fire^10^Horde^Shaman^Narm Skychaser^Kranal Fiss^Call of Fire^^^Find Kranal Fiss in the Barrens.^Long has it been since you were last tested
column2: <name>. You have shown patience thus far in your studies
column3: but the time has come for you to learn more. The time has come for you to learn about destruction... and chaos. The element of fire is yours for the understanding
column4: if you're prepared to pay for it. Seek out Kranal Fiss in the Barrens. He lives in a small dwelling north of the Crossroads
column5: but be mindful
column6: if you've reached the night elf lands
column7: you've gone too far.

column1: Call of Water^20^Horde^Shaman^Swart^Islen Waterseer^Call of Water^^^Find Islen Waterseer in the Barrens.^You look ready for your next test
column2: <name>. You've been patient in your studies
column3: but the time has come for you to learn more. The time has come for you to learn about the purity of water. Seek out Islen Waterseer in the Barrens. She is along the eastern coast
column4: south of the Southfury River and Ratchet. You will find her there at her fishing hut. Good luck to you
column5: <name>.

column1: Call of Water^20^All^Shaman^Narm Skychaser^Islen Waterseer^Call of Water^^^Find Islen Waterseer in the Barrens.^Long has it been since you were last tested
column2: <name>. You have shown patience thus far in your studies
column3: but the time has come for you to learn more. The time has come for you to learn about the purity of water. Seek out Islen Waterseer in the Barrens. She is along the eastern coast
column4: south of the Southfury River and Ratchet. You will find her there at her fishing hut. Good luck to you
column5: <name>.

column1: Gordunni Cobalt^43^Horde^Feralas^Orwin Gizzmick^Orwin Gizzmick^^^^Orwin Gizzmick in Camp Mojache wants 12 samples of Gordunni Cobalt.^I just arrived here in Feralas
column2: and I've heard that the Gordunni Ogres that inhabit the wilds here have some interesting minerals. Who knows what they are up to
column3: but they sure are protective of that stuff! They don't leave it just lying around; no
column4: they bury it to protect folks like me from getting their hands on it. If you'd be willing
column5: I'll give you my shovel. Go to the Gordunni Outpost north of here and dig me up some Gordunni cobalt. Look for the blue glow
column6: then start digging!

column1: Witherbark Cages^45^Alliance^The Hinterlands^Gryphon Master Talonaxe^Gryphon Master Talonaxe^Witherbark Cages^^^Check the cages at the two Witherbark villages
column2: then return to Gryphon Master Talonaxe.^The son of our mightiest gryphon is gone! Swiftwing's heir
column3: Sharpbeak
column4: was lost while hunting with his parents a few days ago
column5: and we believe it was the trolls who took him. You must aid us! Search the cages in the two Witherbark troll villages to see if Sharpbeak is there.

column1: The Altar of Zul^48^Alliance^The Hinterlands^Gryphon Master Talonaxe^Gryphon Master Talonaxe^Witherbark Cages^^^Check the top of the Altar of Zul
column2: then return to Gryphon Master Talonaxe.^Sharpbeak was not with the Witherbark trolls. Perhaps the Vilebranch trolls took him. Go to the Altar of Zul on the western edge of Vilebranch territory and search for the gryphon child.

column1: Thadius Grimshade^47^Alliance^The Hinterlands^Gryphon Master Talonaxe^Thadius Grimshade^Witherbark Cages^^^Bring Sharpbeak's Feather to Thadius Grimshade in the Blasted Lands.^Take this feather to Thadius Grimshade
column2: the diviner. He left Aerie Peak years ago to pursue darker knowledge
column3: but in his heart he is still a Wildhammer! And perhaps his talents can help us find Sharpbeak. This feather was taken from the nest where the gryphon child sleeps. If you give it to Thadius then
column4: with luck
column5: he can use his divining magics to find Sharpbeak. Good luck
column6: <name>. You will find Thadius in the Blasted Lands
column7: in the mage tower of Nethergarde Keep.

column1: Nekrum's Medallion^47^Alliance^Blasted Lands^Thadius Grimshade^Thadius Grimshade^Witherbark Cages^^^Bring Nekrum's Medallion to Thadius Grimshade in the Blasted Lands.^I'll find out where your gryphon is
column2: but first you have to do something for me. There's a troll in Zul'Farrak
column3: Nekrum Gutchewer
column4: who possesses a medallion I would very much like to study. Bring me that Medallion and I'll use my powers to find Sharpbeak. Zul'Farrak is across the ocean to the west
column5: in the desert of Tanaris.

column1: The Divination^47^Alliance^The Hinterlands^Thadius Grimshade^Thadius Grimshade^Witherbark Cages^^^Wait until Grimshade performs the ritual of divination.^Give me room while I perform a ritual of divination. I will find the connection between the feather you brought me and its owner
column2: and follow that connection to Sharpbeak himself. That is... I will if all goes according to plan. If it does not
column3: then... you better close your eyes.

column1: Return to the Hinterlands^47^Alliance^The Hinterlands^Thadius Grimshade^Gryphon Master Talonaxe^Witherbark Cages^^^Speak with Gryphon Master Talonaxe.^Sharpbeak is held in a cage
column2: high on a cliff at the top of Jintha'Alor in the Hinterlands. The key to this cage is possessed by the high priestess of the Vilebranch trolls
column3: Vile Priestess Hexx. There. I have done my part. I bid you fortune on your quest
column4: <name>.

column1: Saving Sharpbeak^51^Alliance^The Hinterlands^Gryphon Master Talonaxe^Gryphon Master Talonaxe^Witherbark Cages^^^Fight to the top of Jintha'Alor
column2: kill Vile Priestess Hexx for the key to Sharpbeak's cage
column3: and save Sharpbeak.^We must save Sharpbeak! Fight your way to the top of Jintha'Alor in the heart of Vilebranch territory
column4: gain the key to Sharpbeak's cage from the vile Priestess Hexx
column5: and then find and save Sharpbeak!

column1: Lines of Communication^47^Horde^Undercity^Oran Snakewrithe^Oran Snakewrithe^^^^Oran Snakewrithe in Undercity wants you to travel to the Hinterlands and burn the Highvale Records
column2: Highvale Report
column3: and Highvale Notes.^The Quel'Danil Lodge is a center of communication for the high elves of the Hinterlands. Their ambassadors are working to establish relationships with other races
column4: with whom they share their knowledge of the Witherbark trolls that inhabit the area in the southern Hinterlands. All of the documents regarding the communications are kept at the lodge. We don't need the Highvale building alliances with others
column5: <name>. Destroy the Highvale documents. We need to burn their lines of communication... literally.

column1: Seeking Strahad^30^Horde^Warlock^Gan'rul Bloodeye^Strahad Farsan^^^^Speak to Strahad Farsan in Ratchet.^I have taught you skills in the past
column2: but the time has come for another to teach you. He is in Ratchet
column3: and his name is Strahad. He is human
column4: but do not let that fool you into thinking he is weak. He is powerful even though he may be small. He can teach you about more powerful summonings--I feel you are ready. Go to him now. He is in Ratchet... above the port town next to his tower.

column1: Tome of Divinity^12^Dwarf^Paladin^Azar Stronghammer^Tiza Battleforge^^^The Tome of Divinity^Speak to Tiza Battleforge in Ironforge.^Hello
column2: <name>. I know you're busy helping out the people of Dun Morogh
column3: but when you have the time
column4: you should make your way up to Ironforge to speak to one of our most respected ilk: Tiza Battleforge. She's the one the younger paladins go to when it's time they learn more about the Light and what's expected of ya. You can find her upstairs in the Hall of Mysteries. If you've never been there
column5: it's in the Mystic Ward. Good luck to ya
column6: <name>.

column1: Tome of Divinity^12^Human^Paladin^Brother Wilhelm^Duthorian Rall^^^The Tome of Divinity^Speak to Duthorian Rall in Stormwind.^Greetings
column2: <brother/sister>. Duthorian Rall
column3: one of our most influential paladins
column4: was speaking about you recently. I overheard him talking about how it was time you be put to the test some... along with some very complimentary things about how well you've performed thus far. If I were you
column5: I'd head to Stormwind and speak to him when you have time. I'm sure he's in the Cathedral of Light--that's where he spends most of his time.

column1: Tome of Divinity^12^Dwarf^Paladin^Brandur Ironhammer^Tiza Battleforge^^^The Tome of Divinity^Speak to Tiza Battleforge in Ironforge^Hello
column2: <name>. I know you're busy helping out the people of Dun Morogh
column3: but when you have the time
column4: you should go upstairs and speak to one of our most respected ilk: Tiza Battleforge. She's the one the younger paladins go to when it's time they learn more about the Light and what's expected of ya.

column1: Tome of Divinity^12^Dwarf^Paladin^Lord Grayson Shadowbreaker^Tiza Battleforge^^^The Tome of Divinity^Speak to Tiza Battleforge in Ironforge.^Hello
column2: <name>. I know you're busy helping out the people of Azeroth
column3: but when you have the time
column4: you should return to Ironforge and speak to one of the most respected paladins of your home: Tiza Battleforge. She's the one the younger dwarven paladins go to when it is time they learn more about the Light and what's expected of all of us. You can find her upstairs in the Hall of Mysteries which is located in the Mystic Ward.

column1: Seeking Strahad^30^Horde^Warlock^Carendin Halgar^Strahad Farsan^^^^Find Strahad Farsan in Ratchet.^I have taught you skills in the past
column2: but the time has come for another to teach you. He is in Ratchet
column3: and his name is Strahad. He is human
column4: but do not let that fool you into thinking he is weak
column5: nor is he your enemy... at least for now. He is powerful and should be respected. He can teach you about greater summonings
column6: summonings I feel you are prepared for. Go to him now. You can find him in Ratchet... above the port town next to the tower there.

column1: The Gordunni Orb^47^Horde^Feralas^Rok Orhan^Uthel'nay^The Gordunni Scroll^^^Bring the Gordunni Orb to Uthel'nay in the Darkbriar Lodge in Orgrimmar.^Although I know my enemy well
column2: I am a warrior
column3: <name>. I cannot begin to tell you what this orb is capable of. I know of a mage in Orgrimmar that will be able to tell us more about the orb. Take it to him.

column1: Handle With Care^47^Alliance^Tanaris^Curgle Cranklehop^Erelas Ambersky^^^^Bring the Carefully-packed Crate to Erelas Ambersky in Rut'theran Village.^<name>
column2: I can see you yearn to be dedicated to my worthwhile cause. Yes
column3: of course
column4: you can do something for me! Take this crate of eggs to Erelas Ambersky. He is a druid that cares for these eggs
column5: helping them to hatch and then training the young hippogryphs. You will find him in Teldrassil
column6: in a small village to the south called Rut'theran.

column1: Troll Temper^45^All^Tanaris^Trenton Lighthammer^Trenton Lighthammer^^^^Bring 20 Vials of Troll Temper to Trenton Lighthammer in Gadgetzan.^The Sandfury trolls of Zul'Farrak make a tempering agent from sandstones
column2: and I can use that to temper the goods I craft
column3: yes I can! It is highly prized by connoisseurs
column4: so if you bring me a good supply of the temper
column5: then I'll reward you well. Zul'Farrak is northwest of Gadgetzan. Good luck.

column1: Dark Heart^50^Horde^Feralas^Talo Thornhoof^Talo Thornhoof^^^^Talo Thornhoof in Camp Mojache wants Edana Hatetalon's Dark Heart.^Edana Hatetalon is the queen of the Northspring harpies that reside in the ruins to the west. She is pure evil; I have heard that her heart is one of crystal. She is void of any emotion aside from the hate she feels towards all others. You must face Edana and bring me back her dark heart. I have heard of a horn that harpies carry -- blowing it by the Hatetalon stones
column2: in the northern part of the ruins
column3: will summon the queen. Imagine her surprise when it is not her kin calling her
column4: but her death.

column1: Vengeance on the Northspring^50^Horde^Feralas^Talo Thornhoof^Talo Thornhoof^^^^Talo Thornhoof wants you to kill 4 Northspring Harpies
column2: 4 Northspring Roguefeathers
column3: 4 Northspring Windcallers
column4: and 4 Northspring Slayers.^In my day
column5: I was a seasoned hunter. There wasn't any creature around that I feared. Until... I was out in the forest
column6: sharpening my blade after a tough battle
column7: when I was ambushed. Harpies surrounded me
column8: and I barely managed to drag myself to safety. Even now
column9: I can still hear their cries echoing... I was never the same after that. But the hate boils inside of me -- I must get even
column10: after all these years. The Northspring harpies can be found to the west of here. <name>
column11: get my revenge.

column1: A Strange Request^45^Horde^Feralas^Witch Doctor Uzer'i^Xerash Fireblade^A Strange Request^^^Take the Shrunken Head to Xerash Fireblade at the Lariss Pavilion in Feralas.^Xerash Fireblade
column2: located at the Lariss Pavilion
column3: north of Camp Mojache
column4: has what I need to get started here! He has mixed up a concoction that I need for my... well
column5: you'll see. Off with you now -- to Xerash. Here
column6: take this with you. It's a shrunken head that I promised Xerash in exchange for the herbs. It's the head of some poor dwarf I ventured across in the forest. I'm sure he will be pleased.

column1: Return to Witch Doctor Uzer'i^45^Horde^Feralas^Xerash Fireblade^Witch Doctor Uzer'i^A Strange Request^^Testing the Vessel^Deliver Xerash's Herb Pouch to Witch Doctor Uzer'i in Feralas.^Here are the herbs
column2: <name>. Take them to Witch Doctor Uzer'i. Please let him know that I am satisfied with the shrunken head.

column1: Testing the Vessel^47^Horde^Feralas^Witch Doctor Uzer'i^Witch Doctor Uzer'i^Testing the Vessel^Return to Witch Doctor Uzer'i^^Kill 10 Ironfur Bears or Longtooth Runners
column2: and use the Beast Muisek Vessel to shrink and capture the fallen beasts.^This will be a test; both of the ritual I performed
column3: and of your abilities. Take this vessel
column4: <name>. With it
column5: you will have the power to shrink and capture a creature inside of it. Travel to the wilderness east of here and look for beasts. The vicious
column6: ironfur bears and longtooth runners are your targets
column7: <name>. Kill them
column8: and use the muisek vessel to shrink and capture them before their spirits can escape.

column1: Hippogryph Muisek^47^Horde^Feralas^Witch Doctor Uzer'i^Witch Doctor Uzer'i^Testing the Vessel^^^Kill 10 Frayfeather Hippogryphs of any type
column2: then use the Muisek Vessel to shrink and capture them.^Since you have proven that you are both trustworthy and gifted with the ability to use the muisek vessel
column3: I now wish you to capture another creature. Hippogryphs have been loyal companions to the night elves for many years; their spirits are loyal and steadfast. Your task is to kill 10 frayfeather hippogryphs
column4: and quickly
column5: shrink and capture them with the vessel
column6: so that their muisek may be preserved. You will find the hippogryphs in the High Wilderness
column7: to the south of here.

column1: Faerie Dragon Muisek^45^Horde^Feralas^Witch Doctor Uzer'i^Witch Doctor Uzer'i^Testing the Vessel^^^Kill 8 Sprite Darters or Sprite Dragons. Use the Muisek Vessel to shrink and capture the fallen Faerie Dragons.^<name>
column2: next I must have you capture a creature that in appearance
column3: may look quite fragile
column4: yet its powerful spirit is what we are truly after. The faerie dragons that I speak of have served the night elves as their allies. We must capture one so that the horde may benefit from this strength of spirit as well. Here is the muisek
column5: <name>. Kill 8 sprite darters or sprite dragons
column6: and capture their muisek. They may be found to the west of here.

column1: Treant Muisek^50^Horde^Feralas^Witch Doctor Uzer'i^Witch Doctor Uzer'i^Testing the Vessel^^^Kill 3 Wandering Forest Walkers. Use the Muisek Vessel to shrink and capture the fallen Treants.^The wandering forest walkers that can be found meandering through the forest are our next target
column2: <name>. Night elves have enlisted treants as allies to fight against the horde. Their movement may be slow
column3: but their role as protectors is undeniable. Soon we will be able to use this power for our own benefit. Find 3 wandering forest walkers; kill them
column4: and use the muisek vessel to shrink and capture them.

column1: Mountain Giant Muisek^50^Horde^Feralas^Witch Doctor Uzer'i^Witch Doctor Uzer'i^Testing the Vessel^^Weapons of Spirit^Kill 7 Land Walkers or Cliff Giants. Use the Muisek Vessel to shrink and capture the fallen Mountain Giants.^The last task I will require of you is to travel to the northwest and find the final enemy. The mountain giants left the mountains to aid the night elves when the burning legion appeared in the world. You will know them by their massive size and the way the ground begins to shake as you travel along their rocky terrain. I am eager to harness power of that size. Kill 7 mountain giants
column2: then use the muisek vessel to capture their powerful muisek.

column1: Natural Materials^50^Horde^Feralas^Witch Doctor Uzer'i^Witch Doctor Uzer'i^^^Weapons of Spirit^Bring 2 Splintered Logs
column2: 6 Encrusted Minerals
column3: 20 pieces of Resilient Sinew
column4: and 40 Metallic Fragments to Witch Doctor Uzer'i in Camp Mojache.^I will need certain materials to complete my endeavor... You may do this alongside the other tasks I will give you. I'll need a splintered log from a treant of Feralas. Encrusted minerals
column5: these can be found on the mountain giants and faerie dragons to the west. Also
column6: find me some resilient sinew from the owlbeasts of the Hinterlands or hippogryphs of Feralas. Finally
column7: I'll need a large amount of metallic fragments from any of these creatures I mentioned.

column1: Weapons of Spirit^50^Horde^Feralas^Witch Doctor Uzer'i^Witch Doctor Uzer'i^^Mountain Giant Muisek
column2: Natural Materials^^Witch Doctor Uzer'i wants you to wait for a moment while he prepares the weapons.^Imbuing the muisek into the weapons is a difficult process. Now that I have all of the required materials and the muisek of the creatures that you captured
column3: I may begin. Please wait; I will return in a moment.

column1: Against the Hatecrest^43^Alliance^Feralas^Shandris Feathermoon^Latronicus Moonspear^Against the Hatecrest^Return to Feathermoon Stronghold^^Report to Latronicus Moonspear in Feathermoon Stronghold.^At this point
column2: I am going to direct you to my second
column3: Latronicus. He's been keeping a close eye on the naga forces to date. I'll assess the general situation here in regards to the naga; as much as I want to commit a full force to move against them
column4: leaving the stronghold open to direct attack from the Horde - or worse - seems less than optimal. Anyway
column5: Latronicus awaits. Good work thus far
column6: <name>. Keep it up. You're dismissed.

column1: Loramus^57^All^Azshara^Loramus Thalipedes^Loramus Thalipedes^Kirith^^^Listen to Loramus Thalipedes tell his story.^So you wish to battle demons? You would do well to listen to my tale.
Gahz'ridian^48^All^Tanaris^Marvon Rivetseeker^Marvon Rivetseeker^^^^Marvon Rivetseeker in Tanaris wants you to collect 30 Gahz'ridian Ornaments.^<name>
column2: I'm a scientist
column3: but also a treasure hunter at heart! Long ago
column4: when trolls used to occupy this land
column5: they created large amounts of ornaments modeled after Gahz'rilla
column6: a hydra they worshipped as a deity. These ornaments are carved out of an element that I call "Gahz'ridian
column7: after the hydra god. I did find some myself, but I'd like to have some more to study -- maybe you can find some? I even invented a detector that makes finding the Gahz'ridian a snap! Just put it on, and the search begins!The Horn of the Beast^43^Alliance^Searing Gorge^Margol's Horn^Mountaineer Pebblebitty^The Horn of the Beast^^^Take Margol's Gigantic Horn to Mountaineer Pebblebitty.^The gigantic horn has numerous scratches and cracks. An unusual metal object is lodged into the rough surface. Upon further examination, you notice that the metal is actually a broken axe head. On the metal, the following words are etched: Property of Mountaineer Pebblebitty. When you try and dislodge the broken axe head, it shatters into a million pieces. Woops!Proof of Deed^43^Alliance^Loch Modan^Mountaineer Pebblebitty^Curator Thorius^The Horn of the Beast^^At Last!^Take Margol's Gigantic Horn to Curator Thorius in Ironforge.^You expect me to believe a story like that? The real horn would have had my broken axe head still lodged into its surface. Listen, take that obvious fake to Curator Thorius in Ironforge. If he can validate your claim, you will receive a proof of deed. Bring that proof back to me and I'll give you the key to the Searing Gorge. Get going!At Last!^43^Alliance^Ironforge^Curator Thorius^Mountaineer Pebblebitty^^Proof of Deed^^Take the Proof of Deed back to Mountaineer Pebblebitty.^I can't believe Pebblebitty doubted the authenticity of the horn. Between you and me, I think she's just jealous. I know she really wanted to kill that beast herself, what with the 'incident' and all. So you need a proof of deed? After the contribution you just made to the museum, it won't be a problem. <Curator Thorius begins to fill out a large document.> There we go! You can take that back to Pebblebitty.Speak with Renferrel^12^All^Silverpine Forest^High Executor Hadrec^Apothecary Renferrel^Escorting Erland^^^Speak with Apothecary Renferrel at the Sepulcher.^While you were out helping our deathstalkers, Apothecary Renferrel sent you a summons. He did not give me details, but he wanted to speak with you about the wolf hearts you had given him.Jorn Skyseer^18^Horde^The Barrens^Sergra Darkthorn^Jorn Skyseer^Sergra Darkthorn^^^Speak with Jorn Skyseer at Camp Taurajo.^Your time with me is over, <name>. To learn more, you must go to Camp Taurajo to the south and speak with Jorn Skyseer. He will continue your guidance.Stolen Silver^18^Horde^The Barrens^Gazrog^Gazrog^Raptor Thieves^^^Bring the Stolen Silver to Gazrog in the Crossroads.^You may have killed the raptors, but the silver they stole must be recovered! I have reports that the raptors have a large grouping of nests south of Ratchet, known as the Raptor Grounds. It is likely that they brought our stolen silver there. Go to this raptor haven and search for the stolen silver. When you find it, return it to me.Mura Runetotem^15^Horde^The Barrens^Tonga Runetotem^Mura Runetotem^^Altered Beings^^Speak with Mura Runetotem at the Sepulcher in Silverpine Forest.^My clanmate, Mura Runetotem, traveled to Silverpine so that she might aid our undead allies. Silverpine is an ailing forest, a dying forest, and it was Mura's hope to bring it new life. Perhaps the strange life found here in the Barrens can help her work in Silverpine. Take a sample of the shells you gathered, and bring it to Mura in Silverpine. She is staying at the Sepulcher. With luck, studying the shell will give her the insight she needs to heal that dying place.Did You Lose This?^50^All^Blacksmithing^Trenton Lighthammer^Trenton Lighthammer^^A Good Head On Your Shoulders, The World At Your Feet, The Mithril Kid^^Wait for Trenton to finish his work.^You have done much for the Order, <name>. The sheer dedication it takes to get this far would have turned away any ordinary person. There is no doubt in my mind, or in the mind of Galvan, that you are one of us. Which is why I think you deserve a little reward. It is nothing really, just a trinket. You may be familiar with its properties, as I do believe it is what brought you to us in the first place.Bring the End^37^Horde^Razorfen Downs^Andrew Brownell^Andrew Brownell^^^^Andrew Brownell wants you to kill Amnennar the Coldbringer and return his skull.^In the Barrens lies a horrid mess of tangled vines called Razorfen Downs. While our first observations of this place revealed little threat, our recent findings are much more serious... The quilboar of Razorfen Downs have aligned themselves with the Scourge. A Lich named Amnennar the Coldbringer rules them now, using the power of his massive consciousness to control their every move. Amnennar has a direct telepathic link to Ner'zhul; we must sever this bond, <name>. An end must come to the Coldbringer.A Refugee's Quandary^3^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Felix Whindlebolt^Felix Whindlebolt^^^^Bring Felix's Box, Felix's Chest and Felix's Bucket of Bolts to Felix Whindlebolt in Anvilmar.^We drove the troggs out of Gnomeregan, but then it all went so horribly wrong! Now our home is completely irradiated, and we gnomes have been scattered all over Dun Morogh. In my haste to get away from the radiation, I lost all my personal belongings and tools. It was the trolls that got them. They stole my chest, my box, and my bucket of bolts! They took them back to their camps southwest of Anvilmar. I'm no adventurer - could you find my things and bring them here to me, please?Thistleshrub Valley^50^All^Tanaris^Tran'rek^Tran'rek^^^^Tran'rek in Gadgetzan wants you to kill 8 Gnarled Thistleshrubs and 8 Thistleshrub Rootshapers.^Have you ever seen Thistleshrub Valley? It's a mighty dangerous place, <name>. Those strange beasts there, I don't trust them for a minute! Gnarled thistleshrubs and thistleshrub rootshapers, that's what I think they were called... Anyhow, I want to get into the valley, but with so many of those thistleshrubs around, there's no way I'm going back there. But here's where you come in -- if you clear some of them out, I just might think about going back. What do you think, <name>? Help me out?Scalding Mornbrew Delivery^5^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Nori Pridedrift^Durnan Furcutter^^^Bring Back the Mug^Take a Scalding Mornbrew to Durnan Furcutter inside Anvilmar before it gets cold!^Gah! I was supposed to get this delicious scalding mornbrew to Durnan Furcutter inside Anvilmar a while ago now, but I had to deliver one to Grelin here first. I'll never make it to Anvilmar before the brew runs cold! You look fast. Maybe you can make it. This cup will only stay hot for a few more minutes, and Durnan didn't order chilly" mornbrew
column8: so get going. Anvilmar is to the northeast
column9: a settlement dug into the mountain. Thanks
column10: <name>
column11: and don't forget to bring me back my mug!

column1: Bring Back the Mug^5^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Durnan Furcutter^Nori Pridedrift^^Scalding Mornbrew Delivery^^Return Nori's Mug to Nori Pridedrift in Coldridge Valley.^Now that hit the spot! Nothing like a piping hot - nay
column2: SCALDING mornbrew on a cold winter's day to warm your cackles of yer soul. Here ya go <name> - be a pal and take this empty mug back to Nori for me
column3: would ya now.

column1: Suntara Stones^46^Alliance^Searing Gorge^Dorius Stonetender^Singed Letter^Suntara Stones^^^Help Dorius get back to Ironforge.^<Dorius groans.> I'm badly injured
column2: <race>. Feel... light headed... World spinning... Bleeding... internally. I must get back to Ironforge. Help me
column3: <name>.

column1: Suntara Stones^46^Alliance^Searing Gorge^Singed Letter^Curator Thorius^Suntara Stones^^^Take the Singed Letter to Thorius in Ironforge. He is in the Hall of Explorers.^Brother
column2: If you are reading this letter
column3: I am no more. How it got to you
column4: I do not know
column5: but thank and reward the ones responsible. About the stones: They exist and the Dark Irons have them in their possession. Their leader
column6: Lathoric the Black
column7: is using the power of the stones to enslave my excavation team. They were taken to the cauldron. Their minds are twisted
column8: working night and day to complete something called Obsidion. Help them
column9: brother. It is the final wish of a dead man. -Dorius

column1: In Nightmares^25^Horde^The Barrens^Falla Sagewind^Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem^^The Glowing Shard^^Bring the Nightmare Shard to Hamuul Runetotem on Elder Rise.^This shard holds great secrets; it is the pure essence of the Emerald Dream. However
column2: what I see in this shard is not a dream; one would call this sort of a vision a nightmare. I do not wish to alarm you
column3: <name>
column4: but I think it is best if you deliver this shard into the hands of a wise druid as soon as you can. Hamuul Runetotem on Elder Rise is who you need to find. Head to Thunder Bluff. I cannot say more.

column1: In Nightmares^25^Alliance^The Barrens^Falla Sagewind^Mathrengyl Bearwalker^^The Glowing Shard^^Bring the Nightmare Shard to Mathrengyl Bearwalker in Darnassus.^This shard holds great secrets; it is the pure essence of the Emerald Dream. However
column2: what I see in this shard is not a dream; one would call this sort of a vision a nightmare. I do not wish to alarm you
column3: <name>
column4: but I think it is best if you deliver this shard into the hands of a wise druid as soon as you can... Mathrengyl Bearwalker in the Cenarion Circle is who you need to find. Head to Darnassus. I cannot say more.

column1: Dwarven Justice^46^Alliance^Ironforge^Curator Thorius^Dying Archaeologist^Suntara Stones^^^Return to the Searing Gorge and find Dorius's archaeology unit.^There is an empty
column2: vacuous hole
column3: where my heart used to be
column4: <name>. The loss of Dorius is not one that I will soon recover from. I must see his final wish through - the perpetrators of this cold blooded murder must be brought to justice. Return to the Searing Gorge and fulfill his last request: Free his men. The Dark Iron dwarves force their slaves to work in a sweltering mine called the Slag Pits. Search there for Dorius' men.

column1: Release Them^46^Alliance^Searing Gorge^Dying Archaeologist^Altar of Suntara^Suntara Stones^^Rise
column2: Obsidion!^Find the Mysterious Artifact being guarded by the Twilight's Hammer Idolaters in the northwest quadrant of the Searing Gorge and bring it to the Altar of Suntara in the Slag Pit.^Release them
column3: <race>. Even after their bodies give out
column4: the power of the Suntara forces them to complete their tasks. The altar of Suntara is the key. Go northwest; in the hills above the cave... Twilight's Hammer guard a relic. Retrieve it and place it on the altar of Suntara. <The dying archaeologist collapses.>

column1: The Essence of Eranikus^55^All^^Essence of Eranikus^Essence Font^^^The Essence of Eranikus^Place the Essence of Eranikus in the Essence Font located in this lair in the Sunken Temple.^As you touch the gem
column2: a deep voice resonates in your mind. "Mortal
column3: heed this plea. I am Eranikus of the Green Dragonflight
column4: keeper of this accursed temple. My charge to ensure that the trolls never again bring forth their abomination of a god has for now ended in failure. As I imbue this gem with part of my essence
column5: I sense my grip on the Dream twisting into chaos. Please - place this gem into the essence font in my lair
column6: and let our magic there purge the taint from my psyche so that I may rest."

column1: The Essence of Eranikus^55^All^Swamp of Sorrows^Oathstone of Ysera's Dragonflight^Itharius^^The Essence of Eranikus^In Eranikus' Own Words^Bring the Oathstone of Ysera's Dragonflight and the Chained Essence of Eranikus to Itharius in the Swamp of Sorrows. It is there that you will make your choice to aid Ysera's Dragonflight or not.^You engage the Oathstone
column2: and Itharius speaks directly to your mind through the stone. "By accepting the charge placed in this Oathstone
column3: you agree to aid my cause and the cause of Ysera's Dragonflight in redeeming the corrupted soul of Eranikus. The first sacrifice
column4: one of many you and I will no doubt make
column5: will be to relinquish the gem to me that has chained what free-willed part of Eranikus' psyche remains." "Do this <name>
column6: and we will work together to redeem a soul worthy of redemption."

column1: Replacement Phial^42^All^Ironforge^Talvash del Kissel^Talvash del Kissel^^^^Bring a Mana Potion
column2: Coal
column3: and Sweet Nectar to Talvash del Kissel in Ironforge to get a replacement for Talvash's Phial of Scrying.^Um... you need another phial of scrying? You're kidding
column4: right? What did you do with the first one?! We have a lot of work ahead of us here
column5: <race>. Those phials don't grow on trees! Actually
column6: I wish they did
column7: because I'd go there and pick one off since I don't have another one!! in order to make you one
column8: I need the following: a mana potion
column9: a piece of coal
column10: and some sweet nectar. Don't ask why
column11: just bring me what I ask and I'll make you a new one.
