column1: Break Sharptusk!^5^All^Mulgore^Brave Windfeather^Brave Windfeather^^^^Bring the head of Chief Sharptusk Thornmantle to Brave Windfeather in Red Cloud Mesa.^<name> - I have heard of you
column2: newcomer. Perhaps it is you that will help us
column3: where others have failed. We tauren have carved a home out of this land
column4: but not without a cost. The Bristleback quilboars of Brambleblade Ravine
column5: led by Chief Sharptusk Thornmantle
column6: have made our lives difficult with their continued war against us. I charge you to bring me the chief's head! He will be found in the ravine to the east in their makeshift village.

column1: Prayer to Elune^50^Alliance^Searing Gorge^Zamael Lunthistle^Zamael Lunthistle^Prayer to Elune^^^Hear Zamael tell his tale.^Will you assist me
column2: mortal? Hear my tale.

column1: Prayer to Elune^50^Alliance^Searing Gorge^Zamael Lunthistle^Astarii Starseeker^Prayer to Elune^^^Find the Prayer to Elune and take it to Astarii Starseeker in Darnassus.^Will you assist me
column2: mortal? Will you find the prayer to Elune? As I stated
column3: the prayer was etched onto a golden tablet. One of these idol worshipping scoundrels must have it on their person. If you do recover my prayer
column4: take it to Astarii Starseeker in Darnassus. It matters little that my faith has been rekindled after the countless malevolent actions that I have taken against this world and its inhabitants
column5: but my prayer must be heard. Absolution is the last thing I expect.

column1: Shadoweaver^50^All^Tailoring^Nilith Lokrav^Nilith Lokrav^Shadoweaver^^^Kill the group of Shadow Silk Poachers that wander the Searing Gorge. Nilith has reason to believe that there are five of them that need to be exterminated. Return to Nilith in the Searing Gorge when this task is complete.^The spiders of the Searing Gorge are an invaluable source of shadow silk. As you know
column2: shadow silk is highly sought after by the artisans of our trade. Recently
column3: a group of poachers has encroached upon these lands
column4: carelessly slaying spiders en masse without so much as a thought as to the long term effect of their actions. The first task I ask of you
column5: then
column6: is a simple one: Find them... and end them. Begin your search to the north. If you require assistance
column7: speak with Raze.

column1: The Sunken Temple^51^Horde^Tanaris^Witch Doctor Uzer'i^Marvon Rivetseeker^The Sunken Temple^^The Stone Circle^Find Marvon Rivetseeker in Tanaris.^There are restless spirits in this world
column2: <name>. There are spirits that have been tainted by their isolation
column3: bound to an ancient evil... I have heard of a place that lies deep below the surface of the earth -- banished there by powers greater than I have ever seen. If you wish to learn more of this place; the Sunken Temple
column4: seek out a goblin named Marvon Rivetseeker. He has studied many ancient areas of the world
column5: and was last known to have left his home in Ratchet to study the troll ruins in Tanaris.

column1: A Crew Under Fire^57^All^Azshara^Captain Vanessa Beltis^Captain Vanessa Beltis^^^^Defend Captain Vanessa Beltis
column2: her crew and the Horizon Scout's passengers against the naga attack. Captain Vanessa Beltis must survive.^We were just off the coast looking for a safe haven to make anchor. The sun hadn't been down for more than an hour when they attacked... those damned naga! I'm not sure what they were looking for
column3: but it's clear they didn't find it--they've already come back once. A couple of my scouts are on watch at the entrance of the valley to give us fair warning when the next attack comes. I'm sorry you've come along now
column4: <name>
column5: but it's out of my hands. Are you ready for the fight of your life?

column1: The Undermarket^50^All^Tailoring^Nilith Lokrav^Nilith Lokrav^Shadoweaver^^^Slay Trade Master Kovic and his minion Clunk. Retrieve the Trader's Satchel from his corpse and return it to Nilith.^They call themselves the Undermarket: Cutthroat traders that will sell
column2: move
column3: trade and do just about anything for the right price. It gets worse
column4: <name>. They have set up a base of operations here in the Searing Gorge. Trade Master Kovic is heading up the operation and has close ties with the Dark Iron dwarves of the region. We must strike hard and send a message to their leadership. Slay Trade Master Kovic and his minion Clunk. Bring back his trader's satchel when the job is done. To the Cauldron!

column1: The Undermarket^50^All^Tailoring^Nilith Lokrav^Vizzklick^Shadoweaver^^^Speak with Vizzklick in Gadgetzan.^I want you to personally deliver the news of Kovic's defeat to Vizzklick in Gadgetzan. He will be so happy to hear that Kovic is dead that I'm certain he'll give you some grand reward.
Divine Retribution^48^All^Searing Gorge^Kalaran Windblade^Kalaran Windblade^^^The Flawless Flame^Listen as Kalaran Windblade tells his story.^Hear my tale
column2: adventurer.

column1: The Flawless Flame^48^All^Searing Gorge^Kalaran Windblade^Kalaran Windblade^The Flawless Flame^Divine Retribution^^Collect 4 Hearts of Flame and 4 globes of Golem Oil and return the items to Kalaran Windblade.^You have made the right decision
column2: <name>. We must strike where we will do the most damage: the four sentry towers. With the four towers in flames
column3: we can initiate an offensive before they have time to react. You will need the proper tool to set the towers ablaze. To make the tool requires some materials. Bring me four hearts of flame and four golem oil and I shall craft the torch of flawless flame. The golems and elementals in these lands should be your first target.

column1: Forging the Shaft^48^All^Searing Gorge^Kalaran Windblade^Kalaran Windblade^The Flawless Flame^^^Bring 8 Thorium Plated Daggers to Kalaran Windblade.^To hold the flawless flame
column2: we will need a shaft and a casing. You must first find a suitable shaft. The Dark Iron taskmasters and slavers of the cauldron use weapons of enchanted thorium
column3: an extremely sturdy alloy. If you bring me eight thorium plated daggers
column4: I can break the alloy down and reforge a shaft.

column1: The Stone Circle^51^All^Tanaris^Marvon Rivetseeker^Marvon Rivetseeker^The Sunken Temple^^Into the Depths
column2: Secret of the Circle^Retrieve the Stone Circle from Marvon Rivetseeker's workshop in Ratchet.^I once entered the foreboding chambers of the Sunken Temple. The evil in that place penetrates all that enter; I barely managed to find my way out
column3: wading through the ooze that now covers the floors. All I can remember is stumbling through a large circular room
column4: filled with serpent statues... Recently
column5: I discovered a round stone that appeared to have the same serpent symbol imprinted on it. I had it packed up and shipped to my workshop in Ratchet. Retrieve it
column6: and I might be able to tell you more.

column1: The Sunken Temple^51^Alliance^Feralas^Angelas Moonbreeze^Marvon Rivetseeker^The Sunken Temple^^The Stone Circle^Find Marvon Rivetseeker in Tanaris.^I have heard of a place that lies deep below the surface of the earth -- banished there by powers greater than I have ever seen. If you wish to learn more of this place; the Sunken Temple
column2: seek out a goblin named Marvon Rivetseeker. Much like Troyas and I
column3: he has studied many ancient areas of the world. He was last known to have left his home in Ratchet to study the troll ruins in Tanaris. Good luck finding him; he hasn't been heard from in some time.

column1: Into the Depths^51^All^^Marvon Rivetseeker^Altar of Hakkar^^The Stone Circle^^Find the Altar of Hakkar in the Sunken Temple in Swamp of Sorrows.^Inside the temple
column2: I found a circular room with six balconies
column3: each one with a serpent statue on the edge. Curious
column4: I pushed one of them to see what would happen
column5: and it was a trap! I nearly fell to my death from the explosion. Laying there on the ledge
column6: I looked down and noticed that there was another statue at the base of the room; an altar of sorts... Hakkar
column7: I think it was called. I think that this altar is the secret -- you must bring this token to the altar in the Sunken Temple.

column1: Secret of the Circle^51^All^^Marvon Rivetseeker^Idol of Hakkar^^The Stone Circle^^Travel into the Sunken Temple and discover the secret hidden in the circle of statues.^My memories are cloudy
column2: but I will tell you what I can. The circle of statues in the Sunken Temple
column3: while dangerous
column4: I believe that they hold the secret to unlock an even greater treasure. From the main altar
column5: I was able to activate a series of lights. I think that if you can uncover what these lights mean
column6: you might be able to unlock whatever secrets are hiding in this room. I warn you though
column7: <name>. Great evil lies in the temple. It's likely that anything valuable will be fervently guarded...

column1: Passing the Burden^52^Alliance^Ironforge^Historian Karnik^Tymor^Passing the Burden^^An Easy Pickup^Speak to Tymor in Ironforge.^I've recently been handed the responsibility of investigating Azshara--a once beautiful area the elves called home. This would be back when they practiced magic. It's now a more dangerous place than it is beautiful
column2: but that doesn't stop us from turning over every stone for answers to our past. A companion of mine named Tymor offered to help me investigate the area since he takes a particular interest in such things. He owns a small place to the right of the Hall of Mysteries here in the city.

column1: Arcane Runes^52^Alliance^Ironforge^Tymor^Pilot Xiggs Fuselighter^Passing the Burden^^^Using the Drawing Kit
column2: make rubbings of the Rune of Beth'Amara
column3: the Rune of Jin'yael
column4: the Rune of Markri
column5: and the Rune of Sael'hai before heading to the small island off of the southern peninsula of Azshara and signaling Pilot Xiggs Fuselighter to pick them up.^Magic was once as revered as Elune herself to some elves. Some of their most powerful mages created runes and tablets citing rules of the arcane and insights into their findings. They would leave these for all to ponder in public places. I would very much like rubbings of these runes from the Ruins of Eldarath. I have a kit for you to make the rubbings with
column6: but it will be up to you to find them. Be careful though
column7: the Explorer's League isn't the only one interested in Eldarath.

column1: An Easy Pickup^52^Alliance^Ironforge^Tymor^Xiggs Fuselighter^An Easy Pickup^Passing the Burden^^Speak to Xiggs Fuselighter in Ironforge.^I want the rubbings delivered to my tower
column2: but there's no need to have you go all the way there. I'll just have them air-lifted out of Azshara. Xiggs Fuselighter owes me a favor or two and will be in the area soon--he's signed on to patrol the coast. Speak to him before you leave. He can give you a flare gun to signal him with. When you have the rubbings
column3: just head to wherever he tells you and then give them to him so he can get them to my tower safely. He should be in the hangar in the Military Ward.

column1: Signal for Pickup^52^Alliance^Ironforge^Xiggs Fuselighter^Xiggs Fuselighter^An Easy Pickup^^Signal for Pickup^Speak to Xiggs Fuselighter and get a Standard Issue Flare Gun from him in Ironforge.^Ah
column2: so Tymor sent you
column3: huh? Yeah
column4: I owe him a favor or two. What's that? Why
column5: that little devil. Yeah
column6: I can help him out with that. So you'll need a flare gun and a location... easy enough. There's a small island off the southern peninsula of Azshara that we've made a landing pad on. You take this flare gun
column7: and use it there. I'll see your signal and come by to pick up this... whatever it is he wants.

column1: The Flame's Casing^50^All^Searing Gorge^Kalaran Windblade^Kalaran Windblade^The Flawless Flame^^^Find and return a Symbol of Ragnaros to Kalaran Windblade.^We need one final piece to form the torch. In the mountains to the northwest you will find a large encampment of Twilight's Hammer. It is rumored that they carry symbols and idols that pay homage to their god. These symbols and idols could carry sufficient enchantment to form a magical casing. Bring me a single symbol of Ragnaros and I will try to extract the magic from the item to create the casing.

The Torch of Retribution^50^All^Searing Gorge^Kalaran Windblade^Kalaran Windblade^The Flawless Flame^^^Wait for Kalaran Windblade to complete the Torch of Retribution.^Give me a moment to combine the pieces and apply the necessary enchantments.

The Torch of Retribution^50^All^Searing Gorge^Kalaran Windblade^Torch of Retribution^The Flawless Flame^^Squire Maltrake^Take the Torch of Retribution.^The torch must now be bound to its owner. Pick up the torch
column2: <name>.

column1: Return to Tymor^52^Alliance^Ironforge^Pilot Xiggs Fuselighter^Tymor^Passing the Burden^^^Return Tymor's Drawing Kit to him in Ironforge.^Tymor didn't give me anything to pay you with
column2: so I suggest you take it up with him when you get back to Ironforge. I'm sure he'll still be in his place in the Mystic Ward. Just go knockin' and make sure he pays you good. This place ain't no picnic... that's for sure. Thanks again for helping him out though
column3: and good luck. Oh
column4: and I don't need the drawing kit. Why don't you just bring it back to Tymor when you go to see him?

column1: Squire Maltrake^50^All^Searing Gorge^Kalaran Windblade^Squire Maltrake^Squire Maltrake^The Torch of Retribution^^Speak with Squire Maltrake.^Speak with my envoy
column2: Squire Maltrake. He will further instruct you as to the use of the Torch of Retribution.

column1: Set Them Ablaze!^52^All^Searing Gorge^Squire Maltrake^Squire Maltrake^Squire Maltrake^^Trinkets...^Set the North
column2: South
column3: East
column4: and West Sentry Towers on fire by using the Torch of Retribution inside each of the buildings.^Listen well
column5: <name>. While the four towers can never be destroyed
column6: you can use the torch of retribution to set them ablaze for a very long period of time: A fire that no element or force can subdue. While they are ablaze
column7: no guard or sentry unit can inhabit the watch posts and thus
column8: their first line of defense is nullified. You must enter each tower and use the Torch of Retribution within their fortifications. Beware the lookouts posted by the Dark Irons
column9: <name>.

column1: Trinkets...^50^All^Searing Gorge^Hoard of the Black Dragonflight^Hoard of the Black Dragonflight^^Set Them Ablaze!^A Taste of Flame^Open the chest.^The chest appears locked.

Everything Counts In Large Amounts^55^All^Blasted Lands^Kum'isha the Collector^Kum'isha the Collector^Everything Counts In Large Amounts^^^Bring Kum'isha Imperfect Draenethyst Fragments and be rewarded for each one you turn in.^Although you may never find a flawless sphere of draenethyst
column2: you will undoubtedly uncover various imperfect fragments of the draenethyst in your exploration of these lands. While it is doubtful that Kum'isha will be able to use the flawed fragments to return home
column3: the pieces may serve other
column4: useful purposes for the draenei. Return any piece of flawed draenethyst fragments that you may find and I shall reward you.

column1: One Draenei's Junk...^55^All^Blasted Lands^Kum'isha the Collector^Kum'isha the Collector^Everything Counts In Large Amounts^^^Bring Kum'isha Imperfect Draenethyst Fragments. Any form of monster in the Blasted Lands could be carrying a fragment.^Well
column2: after that display of voracious greed
column3: I feel nauseous. Regardless
column4: I shall not dwell too long on your material addiction. For each imperfect draenethyst fragment you turn in
column5: I shall reward you with more junk. My junk heap gets smaller while your junk heap gets larger. On Draenor we call this a 'win-win' situation.

column1: Betrayed^53^All^Orgrimmar^Belgrom Rockmaul^Ag'tor Bloodfist^Betrayed^^^Deliver the Sealed Letter to Ag'tor to Ag'tor Bloodfist in Azshara.^Betraying
column2: thieving woman! That's what I call her--that's all she'll ever be! I may have made a grave mistake
column3: <name>. I trusted a blood elf. What's worse
column4: I trusted a woman! She claimed Azshara would hold great riches... powerful items. I simply send some warriors with her to protect her and I would be rewarded. Well
column5: look who's the fool--she's killed them all. I want vengeance
column6: <name>
column7: but I can't afford to send anyone else. Find Ag'tor at Valormok
column8: north of the Haldarr Encampment. He'll tell you more.

column1: Betrayed^53^All^Orgrimmar^Ag'tor Bloodfist^Kaldorei Tome of Summoning^Betrayed^^^Kill 10 Blood Elf Reclaimers
column2: and 10 Blood Elf Surveyors before seeking out Magus Rimtori's camp. Once you've found it
column3: look for something that might be important to her that can be used to draw her into a fight.^I thought as much. We start our crusade against her workers along the southern bluffs on the northern peninsula of Azshara. Kill them with bloody rage--let them know they've betrayed the wrong allies. Do not concern yourself with her yet--she spends most of her time with her bodyguards searching Azshara. It would be prudent after you've slain her workers to find her personal camp. Scouting out where we can attack her would be wise. Perhaps there is something there we can use to provoke her.

column1: Betrayed^56^All^Orgrimmar^Kaldorei Tome of Summoning^Ag'tor Bloodfist^Betrayed^^^Destroy the arcane focusing crystal tied to Magus Rimtori and then slay her. Afterwards
column2: take the Head of Magus Rimtori to Ag'tor Bloodfist in Azshara.^A few more moments of thought brings a few ideas to mind
column3: one of which brings a smile to your face: perhaps destroying the crystals would upset the blood elf responsible for the slaughter of so many orcs and the betrayal of Belgrom? You continue to decipher more of the script and pictures and realize that one of the crystals is tied to the creator of the circle--the others are tied to something far more sinister. You close the book and begin to decide which crystal to destroy.

column1: Betrayed^56^All^Orgrimmar^Ag'tor Bloodfist^Belgrom Rockmaul^Betrayed^^^Speak to Belgrom Rockmaul in Orgrimmar.^Return to Belgrom in Orgrimmar. He will want to see her head for himself! We'll return there shortly. Ah
column2: this is indeed a good day. Thank you for your help
column3: <name>.

column1: Breaking the Ward^58^All^Azshara^Loramus Thalipedes^Loramus Thalipedes^Kirith^^^Wait for Loramus to complete the enlightenment spell.^You are foolhardy
column2: <name>. It is an admirable quality of your kind - to blindly enter battle when you have little to no chance of success. I will assist you
column3: if only to see just one of Razelikh's minions fall. To break the ward placed over Razelikh's subordinates will take time and require the acquisition of rare artifacts. Be still
column4: I must first perform the enlightenment ritual. The information I gather will assist me in forging weapons of great power.

column1: The Name of the Beast^58^All^Azshara^Loramus Thalipedes^Lord Arkkoroc^Kirith^^^Speak with Lord Arkkoroc in Azshara. Begin your search at the waters edge to find the Temple of Arkkoran.^There is only one way to harm the demon lord and his minions. A weapon of power must be forged bearing his true name. When such a weapon is forged
column2: the demon and all under his command are vulnerable. A lesser deity resides in Azshara: Lord Arkkoroc. You must seek him out but be warned
column3: his minions will stop at nothing to destroy you if you are discovered. Undoubtedly
column4: you will have to pay a price for such information.

column1: The Name of the Beast^58^All^Azshara^Lord Arkkoroc^Lord Arkkoroc^Kirith^^^Slay Hetaera and bring back Hetaera's Bloodied Head
column2: Hetaera's Beaten Head
column3: and Hetaera's Bruised Head to Lord Arkkoroc.^She kills my children
column4: mortal. She that calls herself the ruler of these oceans. A false god
column5: nothing more. Crush her and bring back all of her heads. For that
column6: you will be given the name that you seek and something else of equal importance. She roams the clutch... Hetaera she is called. <Lord Arkkoroc points to the southwest.> Go!

column1: The Name of the Beast^58^All^Azshara^Lord Arkkoroc^Loramus Thalipedes^Kirith^^^Take the temper back to Loramus Thalipedes.^As promised
column2: I will reveal the name of the demon lord
column3: Razelikh the Defiler. First
column4: however
column5: I must prepare something of utmost importance for your journey. The weapon you seek to create requires a temper. Give me a moment to drain the blood from these heads. <Lord Arkkoroc squeezes the heads in between his gigantic fists
column6: draining them of their blood.> Take the temper back to Loramus along with the name of the beast: Rakh'likh.

column1: In Eranikus' Own Words^55^ ^Swamp of Sorrows^Itharius^Umbranse the Spiritspeaker^^The Essence of Eranikus^^Travel to the eastern part of Winterspring and speak with Umbranse the Spiritspeaker.^<name>
column2: our first step will be to devise a method to speak with Eranikus through the gem. He lies in a precarious state between sleep and death now
column3: twisted within a weave of nightmares. Though the essence you have given me is badly tainted
column4: there is a chance we can reach him. Travel far to the icy lands of eastern Winterspring and seek one of our mortal allies
column5: Umbranse the Spiritspeaker. He is a human medium who speaks for the dead. Though Eranikus is not truly dead
column6: he may be of aid to us still.

column1: The Runed Scroll^25^Horde^The Barrens^Runed Scroll^Kadrak^The Runed Scroll^^^Take the Runed Scroll to the northern guard tower in the Barrens.^The official-looking scroll is wrapped tightly with a silvery ribbon. You're sure someone would be interested in seeing this
column2: but who? There is an outpost close to the Ashenvale border to the north
column3: and if the information on this scroll involves the night elves
column4: this would be the place to take it.

column1: Horde Presence^29^Horde^The Barrens^Kadrak^Kadrak^The Runed Scroll^^^Kill the leader of the Talon Den
column2: Rynthariel the Keymaster.^This scroll is from that scheming dryad Rynthariel
column3: Keymaster of the Talon Den on Stonetalon Peak. She'll not be making any more contact with the messenger you looted this from
column4: heh
column5: but we must stand our ground here. The Horde will not tolerate her outrunners here. <name>
column6: travel to the Talon Den. Kill Rynthariel
column7: and then put up a symbol for all to see. Take this Horde flag
column8: <name>. Put it up in the Talon Den so that they will not be so rash as to send another messenger through our territory again.

column1: Stealing Knowledge^52^All^Azshara^Jediga^Jediga^^^Delivery to Magatha
column2: Delivery to Jes'rimon
column3: Delivery to Andron Gant
column4: Delivery to Archmage Xylem^Find the Tablet of Beth'Amara
column5: the Tablet of Jin'yael
column6: the Tablet of Markri
column7: and the Tablet of Sael'hai before returning to Jediga in Azshara.^I admit
column8: <name>
column9: I've made the most of my situation in Azshara. Belgrom's punishment has had its share of benefits. Before I left
column10: I did some research and you would be surprised how many valuable items are lying around. I'll tell you more about my deals
column11: and even give you a cut of the profits
column12: if you help me gather some of them. There are tablets throughout the Ruins of Eldarath to the east that I need. All four are named after Highborne wizards. Get them for me and we'll talk some more.

column1: Delivery to Magatha^52^All^Azshara^Jediga^Magatha Grimtotem^Delivery to Magatha^Stealing Knowledge^^Bring the Tablet of Beth'Amara to Magatha in Thunder Bluff.^The first tablet goes to a tauren female... one called Magatha. She is among the elders in Thunder Bluff
column2: and is one of the proponents of the alliance between the tauren and the Forsaken. She
column3: more than anyone among the elders
column4: feels the tauren and their ways can help the Forsaken find a path back to being human. Bring her the Tablet of Beth'Amara. The tablet may be the link she needs in finding a way to help the Forsaken... or so she claims.

column1: A Friend in Need^4^All^Teldrassil^Iverron^Dirania Silvershine^A Friend in Need^A Good Friend^^Speak to Dirania Silvershine in Shadowglen.^Ughhh... I was bitten very badly by a spider named Githyiss the Vile while exploring the spider cave very close to here. I am sure I have been seriously poisoned; you must help me. Please tell Dirania Silvershine. She will be able to help me. Hurry... I'm so dizzy...
Screecher Spirits^44^All^Tanaris^Yeh'kinya^Yeh'kinya^Screecher Spirits^^^Capture the spirits of 3 screechers in Feralas
column2: then return to Yeh'kinya in Steamwheedle Port.^I seek the spirits of the vale screechers of Feralas. They are the cousins of an old
column3: old god
column4: and their spirits are linked to him. Take this bramble wand and go to Feralas. Find and defeat vale screechers in southern and central Feralas
column5: then wave my bramble over their fallen bodies. This will coax their spirit to reveal itself. Touch the spirit and collect its essence. Return to me with my bramble and with the collected essence
column6: and I will tell you more of the old god of which I spoke.

column1: Iverron's Antidote^4^All^Teldrassil^Dirania Silvershine^Dirania Silvershine^A Friend in Need^^Iverron's Antidote^Collect 7 Hyacinth Mushrooms
column2: 4 Moonpetal Lilies
column3: and 1 Webwood Ichor for Dirania Silveshine in Shadowglen.^We may be able to help Iverron
column4: as I know of an antidote that should help with the poison. It requires some ingredients
column5: though
column6: before I can make it. I'll need Hyacinth mushrooms. You can find these growing under trees
column7: or you may collect them from the grell south of here; they seem to have taken a liking to them. I'll also need Moonpetal lilies
column8: which only grow around watery pools. The last ingredient may prove the most difficult. From the very spiders that poisoned Iverron
column9: collect Webwood ichor.

column1: Iverron's Antidote^4^All^Teldrassil^Dirania Silvershine^Iverron^^Iverron's Antidote^^Bring Iverron's Antidote to Iverron before the time limit is up. Iverron can be found by the cave to the north.^The antidote is ready
column2: <name>. Please see that Iverron drinks it. There is something that you should know -- the antidote -- it will only remain viable for 5 minutes. You must get it to him in time. Speed be with you
column3: <name>.

column1: Scourge of the Downs^37^All^Razorfen Downs^Belnistrasz^Belnistrasz^Scourge of the Downs^^^If you agree to aid Belnistrasz
column2: speak with him again and hand the Oathstone he gave you back to him.^Outstanding! My name is Belnistrasz
column3: and I thank you for rescuing me. I had given myself up for dead... or worse
column4: as a meal for these Scourge-infested vermin. Yes - I said Scourge all right; they've brokered some sort of deal with the Quilboar here
column5: and this nightmare is a result. Listen... rather than just flee
column6: I want to make a difference for all of our sakes. Would you be up to helping me out to that end? It's probably dangerous
column7: but you seem to be the type not to worry about that too much.

column1: Washed Ashore^13^All^Darkshore^Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde^Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde^Washed Ashore^^^Recover Sea Creature Bones from the beached sea creature just south of Auberdine
column2: and then return with it to Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine.^Majestic sea creatures are known to launch themselves at the Darkshore coastline
column3: beached there until they die. Lately
column4: these beasts have been washing ashore in ever-increasing numbers. I've been sent here by the Temple of the Moon to investigate
column5: but the presence of murlocs along the water has made my research difficult. There is a giant creature washed ashore just south of Auberdine that is ringed by the foul Greymist murlocs. Could you go there and retrieve bones from the creature for our study?

column1: Extinguishing the Idol^37^All^Razorfen Downs^Belnistrasz^Belnistrasz's Brazier^Scourge of the Downs^^^Escort Belnistrasz to the Quilboar's idol in Razorfen Downs.^Near the entrance is an idol that functions as a macabre oven for the Quilboar; the beasts... they literally consume their abductees from the Barrens. I can shut down the idol and bind them from using it again
column2: but I need your aid in doing so. My plan: escort me to the idol. Once we arrive
column3: I'll commence the ritual. I'll barely be able to communicate with you
column4: let alone defend myself. Protect me while I shut down the idol. If they take me down
column5: then it's all over for us. Are you with me?!

column1: Goblin Engineering^10^Horde^Engineering^Graham Van Talen^Nixx Sprocketspring^^^The Pledge of Secrecy^If you wish to learn more about Goblin Engineering
column2: take the Manual of Engineering Disciplines to Nixx Sprocketspring in Gadgetzan.^Expert engineering yields two distinct disciplines: gnome and goblin. Clearly
column3: goblin engineering is the choice of all brilliant engineers. Learn to master the world through the judicious use of high explosives and fantastic gear! <name>
column4: read this manual. If you want to learn about goblin engineering
column5: then take it to Nixx Sprocketspring in Gadgetzan. Remember - membership is permanent and prevents joining the other discipline
column6: so make sure this is what you want before finishing his task.

column1: The Prophecy of Mosh'aru^47^All^Tanaris^Yeh'kinya^Yeh'kinya^Screecher Spirits^^^Bring the First and Second Mosh'aru Tablets to Yeh'kinya in Tanaris.^The ancient prophecy of Mosh'aru speaks of a way to contain the god Hakkar's essence. It was written on two tablets and taken to the troll city of Zul'Farrak
column2: west of Gadgetzan. Bring me the Mosh'aru tablets! The first tablet is held by the long-dead troll Theka the Martyr. It is said his persecutors were cursed into scarabs and now scuttle about his shrine. The second tablet is held by the hydromancer Velratha
column3: near the sacred pool of Gahz'rilla. When you have the tablets
column4: bring them to me.

column1: The God Hakkar^53^All^Tanaris^Yeh'kinya^Yeh'kinya^Screecher Spirits^^The Lost Tablets of Mosh'aru^Bring the Filled Egg of Hakkar to Yeh'kinya in Tanaris.^Now it is time to capture the essence of the avatar of Hakkar. Take the Egg of Hakkar to the Sanctum of the Fallen God in the Sunken Temple in Azeroth. Invoke the egg's power to stir the dead god. He will send his minions against you. Defeat his bloodrinkers and take their Hakkari blood
column2: then use the blood to dowse the eternal flames that hold Hakkar's spirit. When all the flames go out
column3: the avatar of Hakkar will enter our world. Defeat him
column4: and place his essence within the egg of Hakkar.

column1: Delivery to Jes'rimon^52^All^Azshara^Jediga^Jes'rimon^Delivery to Jes'rimon^Stealing Knowledge^^Bring the Tablet of Jin'yael to Jes'rimon in Orgrimmar.^I have a fence in Orgrimmar. He resides in The Drag. He's difficult to nail down if you don't know where to look
column2: but if you go looking in one of the highest buildings there you should have no problem finding him. Do me a favor though
column3: don't go shouting to all of Kalimdor that he's there and what his business is--it'd be bad for both of us. He'll give us more than a fair price for the Tablet of Jin'yael. I'm not sure why
column4: but you should have seen how excited he was to hear about its whereabouts.

column1: Delivery to Andron Gant^52^All^Azshara^Jediga^Andron Gant^Delivery to Andron Gant^Stealing Knowledge^^Bring the Tablet of Markri to Andron Gant in Undercity.^Andron Gant is my next contact. He usually holds himself up in the Undercity... right near the Apothecarium. He was a little more loose-lipped when it came to speaking about what he wanted the Tablet for. Apparently some of the mages of Undercity are looking to study some of the arcane spells the highborne used. They think this tablet will help them. Markri was adept at summoning creatures; especially elementals. Take the Tablet of Markri and return to me for your part of the reward.

Delivery to Archmage Xylem^52^All^Azshara^Jediga^Archmage Xylem^Delivery to Archmage Xylem^Stealing Knowledge^^Bring the Tablet of Sael'hai to Archmage Xylem in Azshara.^This final tablet goes to someone very dangerous
column2: <name>. Heed me when I tell you that I trust this person far less than anyone else I've asked you to meet with. Archmage Xylem has a tower up in the hills overlooking Azshara. He's human
column3: but he acts like no human I've met... or killed. He exudes power
column4: and I dare not ask him what he plans on doing with the tablet. He came to me
column5: but told me that his bodyguard Sanath would help me get to the tower when I was ready to meet him. Look north for Sanath.

column1: Magatha's Payment to Jediga^52^Horde^Azshara^Magatha Grimtotem^Jediga^Delivery to Magatha^^^Deliver Magatha's Note to Jediga in Azshara.^Take this note to Jediga. Tell her the payment will be here for her when she returns. And tell her I am pleased with her work. Go swiftly
column2: <name>. Tell your master I will be awaiting her here.

column1: Jes'rimon's Payment to Jediga^52^All^Azshara^Jes'rimon^Jediga^Delivery to Jes'rimon^^^Deliver Jes'rimon's Note to Jediga in Azshara.^Take this letter to Jediga. Let her know that our deal has been beneficial and I be pleased with her work. You tell her she come back to Orgrimmar fast and Jes'rimon make sure he take good care of her. Tell her that
column2: and maybe in the future I have need of your services again
column3: <name>.

column1: Andron's Payment to Jediga^52^All^Azshara^Andron Gant^Jediga^Delivery to Andron Gant^^^Deliver Andron's Note to Jediga in Azshara.^Here... take... this to Jediga. Good luck to ya!
Xylem's Payment to Jediga^52^All^Azshara^Archmage Xylem^Jediga^Delivery to Archmage Xylem^^^Deliver Xylem's Note to Jediga in Azshara.^What is it? Oh yes
column2: your payment. Of course. Take this and be off with you. I'm sure Jediga is awaiting oh so patiently for your return.

column1: Rise
column2: Obsidion!^46^Alliance^Searing Gorge^Dying Archaeologist^Curator Thorius^^Release Them^^Slay Lathoric the Black and Obsidion
column3: and return to Thorius in Ironforge with the Head of Lathoric the Black and the Heart of Obsidion.^It... It... It was all a trap. Forgive... me. Kill the traitor... Kill him for us... for Thorius.

column1: Seeping Corruption^52^Horde^Undercity^Chemist Cuely^Chemist Cuely^^^Seeping Corruption^Fill all 4 Empty Vials at the tide pools along the coast of the Ruins of Eldarath in Azshara before returning to Chemist Cuely.^See that tauren behind me--the one who looks like she's going to be ill at any moment? She was in Azshara recently. She claims she was wounded by some naga while making her way through the Ruins of Eldarath. After fighting off a few of them
column2: she took a break on the beach and drank from one of the tide pools. Now she's feeling nauseous... among other things. I'd like to find out what she drank. Take this box
column3: in it are some empty vials I labeled. Fill each at different pools and come back.

column1: Seeping Corruption^52^Horde^Undercity^Chemist Cuely^Thersa Windsong^^Seeping Corruption^Seeping Corruption^Give Cuely's Elixir to Thersa Windsong in Undercity.^Give this to Thersa. Perhaps it will cure her... perhaps not. We really won't know until after she drinks it.
Kim'jael Indeed!^53^All^Azshara^Kim'jael^Kim'jael^^^Kim'jael's "Missing" Equipment^Search the Thalassian Base Camp for Kim'jael's Compass
column2: Scope
column3: Stuffed Chicken and Wizzlegoober
column4: then return them to him in Azshara.^Kim'jael indeed!! Do you know what Kim'jael means to the Blood elves
column5: <name>? Little rat... or something like that. The big bullies! They hired me to help them scout the area looking for some sort of lost treasures. Of course I jumped aboard the moment they said "treasure" and the amount they were willing to pay
column6: but of course
column7: they turned on me and tried to kill me... ME! Goes to show you
column8: you can't trust a Blood elf. The problem is
column9: they still have my equipment and I can't get it back. Help me out?

column1: Azsharite^58^All^Azshara^Loramus Thalipedes^Loramus Thalipedes^Kirith^^The Formation of Felbane^Recover twenty Crystallized Azsharite from southern Azshara. You may use the Felhound to assist you in 'sniffing' out the location of cleverly hidden deposits.^The ancient cliff giants of the southern region of Azshara consume the rock and buildings of the land for sustenance. The excrement from their consumption is a highly malleable and extremely strong crystal known as Azsharite. The formations litter the southern arc
column2: but few are ever recovered due to the extremely violent nature of the giants. You are to venture south and recover enough of the Azsharite for the creation of the weapon's body. My felhounds will aid in the recovery of the crystal.

column1: The Formation of Felbane^58^All^Azshara^Loramus Thalipedes^Galvan the Ancient^The Formation of Felbane^Azsharite^^Take the Shipment to Galvan the Ancient in Stranglethorn Vale.^The weapons are ready to be forged. You must take the tempered azsharite to one with the ability to harness fel energy. In Stranglethorn Vale such a blacksmith exists. Galvan the Ancient
column2: leader of the Mithril Order
column3: will craft the weapons to your specifications. You will find his encampment between Zul'Gurub and the Mosh'Ogg ogre mound. May your determination and faith carry you through this ordeal. Should you fail
column4: know that your God smiles down upon you
column5: mortal.

column1: Enchanted Azsharite Fel Weaponry^58^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Galvan the Ancient^Galvan the Ancient^The Formation of Felbane^^^Wait for Galvan to finish forging the weaponry.^<name>
column2: the creation of each weapon will take some time. Additionally
column3: you may only use the power of the Felcurse once per three minutes. Its weakening properties against Razelikh the Defiler and his minions may be variable in duration. This is why you must release the Felcurse only when the moment is right! Now give me a moment to craft your weapon
column4: <name>.

column1: Return to the Blasted Lands^58^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Galvan the Ancient^Fallen Hero of the Horde^The Formation of Felbane^^^Return to the Fallen Hero of the Horde at Splinterspear Junction in Swamp of Sorrows.^The hour of redemption is near
column2: <name>. You must return to the Blasted Lands with your new-found weaponry and speak with the Fallen Hero of the Horde to receive your final objective.

column1: Uniting the Shattered Amulet^60^All^Blasted Lands^Fallen Hero of the Horde^Fallen Hero of the Horde^The Formation of Felbane^^^Slay Grol the Destroyer
column2: Lady Sevine
column3: and Archmage Allistarj. From their corpses take the Amulet of Grol
column4: the Amulet of Sevine
column5: and the Amulet of Allistarj.^To reach the Defiler
column6: you must first destroy the triad of power and recover the amulet pieces. When you recover all three pieces
column7: return to me and I shall give you further instruction. Go <name>! To the Blasted Lands! Sevine
column8: Allistarj
column9: and Grol must fall!

column1: You Are Rakh'likh
column2: Demon^60^All^Blasted Lands^Fallen Hero of the Horde^Fallen Hero of the Horde^The Formation of Felbane^^^Destroy Razelikh the Defiler and return the Severed Horn of the Defiler to the Fallen Hero of the Horde. You will also need to return the Ward of the Defiler so that the Fallen Hero can destroy it
column3: preventing it from ever falling into the wrong hands.^Razelikh's lair is atop the highest mountain in the Blasted Lands. The only way to the lair is through the use of the teleport runes near the mountain. As long as you hold the amulet
column4: you can freely transport up to the lair. Once you reach the lair
column5: you must conjure the beast. The amulet is your key
column6: <name>. Use it on the Altar of the Defiler. Should you defeat the Defiler
column7: bring back his horn. It will become a symbol of hope for all that view it - proof that heroes do exist in this war torn world.

column1: Goblin Engineering^10^Alliance^Engineering^Springspindle Fizzlegear^Nixx Sprocketspring^^^The Pledge of Secrecy^If you wish to learn more about Goblin Engineering
column2: take the Manual of Engineering Disciplines to Nixx Sprocketspring in Gadgetzan.^Expert engineering yields two distinct disciplines: gnome and goblin. I only bother to mention goblin engineering because I'm a fair trainer. They like to make things that blow up
column3: and they rarely care what is in the way - even themselves. <name>
column4: read this manual. If you want to learn how to blow yourself up
column5: then take it to Nixx Sprocketspring in Gadgetzan. Remember - membership is permanent and prevents joining the other discipline
column6: so make sure this is what you want before finishing his task.

column1: Gnome Engineering^10^Alliance^Engineering^Lilliam Sparkspindle^Tinkmaster Overspark^^^The Pledge of Secrecy^If you wish to learn more about Gnome Engineering
column2: take the Manual of Engineering Disciplines to Tinkmaster Overspark in Ironforge.^Engineering at the expert level breaks into two disciplines: gnome and goblin. Gnome engineering represents by far the superior of the two! It's about the construction of wonderful gadgets and devices that make life better! <name>
column3: read this manual. If you want to learn more on gnome engineering
column4: then take that manual to Tinkmaster Overspark in Ironforge. Remember - membership is permanent and prevents joining the other discipline
column5: so make sure you are sure before finishing his task!

column1: Gnome Engineering^10^Alliance^Engineering^Springspindle Fizzlegear^Tinkmaster Overspark^^^The Pledge of Secrecy^If you wish to learn more about Gnome Engineering
column2: take the Manual of Engineering Disciplines to Tinkmaster Overspark in Ironforge.^Engineering at the expert level breaks into two disciplines: gnome and goblin. Gnome engineering represents by far the superior of the two! It's about the construction of wonderful gadgets and devices that make life better! <name>
column3: read this manual. If you want to learn more on gnome engineering
column4: then take that manual to Tinkmaster Overspark here in Ironforge. Remember - membership is permanent and prevents joining the other discipline
column5: so make sure you are sure before finishing his task!

column1: Goblin Engineering^10^All^Engineering^Tinkerwiz^Nixx Sprocketspring^^^The Pledge of Secrecy^If you wish to learn more about Goblin Engineering
column2: take the Manual of Engineering Disciplines to Nixx Sprocketspring in Gadgetzan in Tanaris.^Expert engineering yields two distinct disciplines: gnome and goblin. Clearly
column3: goblin engineering is the choice of all brilliant engineers. Learn to master the world through the judicious use of high explosives and fantastic gear! <name>
column4: read this manual. If you want to learn about goblin engineering
column5: then take it to Nixx Sprocketspring in Gadgetzan. Remember - membership is permanent and prevents joining the other discipline
column6: so make sure this is what you want before finishing his task.

column1: Gnome Engineering^10^Alliance^Engineering^Tinkerwiz^Tinkmaster Overspark^^^The Pledge of Secrecy^If you wish to learn more about Gnome Engineering
column2: take the Manual of Engineering Disciplines to Tinkmaster Overspark in Ironforge.^Engineering at the expert level breaks into two disciplines: gnome and goblin. While I think it is a waste
column3: you should be aware of gnome specialization. They make items and gadgets that claim to change the world
column4: but rarely often work. <name>
column5: read this manual. If you wish to learn how to make metal paper weights
column6: then take that manual to Tinkmaster Overspark in Ironforge. Remember - membership is permanent and prevents joining the other discipline
column7: so make sure you are sure before finishing his task!

column1: Gnome Engineering^10^Horde^Engineering^Graham Van Talen^Oglethorpe Obnoticus^^^The Pledge of Secrecy^If you wish to learn more about Gnome Engineering
column2: take the Manual of Engineering Disciplines to Oglethorpe Obnoticus in Booty Bay.^Engineering at the expert level breaks into two disciplines: gnome and goblin. While I think it is a waste
column3: you should be aware of gnome specialization. They make items and gadgets that claim to change the world
column4: but rarely work. <name>
column5: read this manual. If you wish to learn how to make metal paper weights
column6: then take the manual to Oglethorpe Obnoticus in Booty Bay. Remember - membership is permanent and prevents joining the other discipline
column7: so make sure you are sure before finishing his task.

column1: Bring the Light^37^Alliance^Razorfen Downs^Archbishop Benedictus^Archbishop Benedictus^^^^Archbishop Bendictus wants you to slay Amnennar the Coldbringer in Razorfen Downs.^The Scourge is a persistent threat to the Alliance
column2: a fact I am sure you know quite well. Recently
column3: we have come across some very peculiar findings
column4: <name>. In the Barrens lies a horrid tangle of briars called Razorfen Downs. While once it was the home of simple quilboar
column5: now it has become apparent that a pact was made with the Scourge
column6: creating creatures far worse... They are now ruled by the lich
column7: Amnennar the Coldbringer. Align yourself with the Light
column8: <name>; put an end to this evil union.

column1: Gnome Engineering^10^Horde^Engineering^Tinkerwiz^Oglethorpe Obnoticus^^^The Pledge of Secrecy^If you wish to learn more about Gnome Engineering
column2: take the Manual of Engineering Disciplines to Oglethorpe Obnoticus in Booty Bay.^Engineering at the expert level breaks into two disciplines: gnome and goblin. While I think it is a waste
column3: you should be aware of gnome specialization. They make items and gadgets that claim to change the world
column4: but rarely work. <name>
column5: read this manual. If you wish to learn how to make metal paper weights
column6: then take the manual to Oglethorpe Obnoticus in Booty Bay. Remember - membership is permanent and prevents joining the other discipline
column7: so make sure you are sure before finishing his task.

column1: Favored of Elune?^47^Alliance^Teldrassil^Erelas Ambersky^Erelas Ambersky^^^Moontouched Wildkin^Collect 15 Wildkin Feathers from the Hinterlands for Erelas Ambersky in Rut'theran Village.^Wildkin are quite unpredictable creatures
column2: <name>. Capable of incredible gentleness
column3: these creatures will show extreme ferocity if something they deem important is threatened. These beasts are rumored to have been created by Elune
column4: and I am interested in finding if this is really the truth. Recently
column5: I heard about a population of wildkin living in the Hinterlands -- Vicious
column6: Primitive
column7: and Savage Owlbeasts. They can be found amongst the wildlife there. Will you gather some wildkin feathers for me?

column1: Tome of Divinity^12^Human^Paladin^Brandur Ironhammer^Duthorian Rall^^^The Tome of Divinity^Speak with Duthorian Rall in Stormwind.^Sorry to interrupt your travels
column2: <race>
column3: but I thought you should know that word was sent from Stormwind recently asking that paladins report there for training. If I didn't know any better
column4: I'd say your close to reaching a special time and it's time you started studying the Tomes. Look for Duthorian Rall in Stormwind. He usually trains paladins in the Cathedral of Light.

column1: The Smoldering Ruins of Thaurissan^54^Alliance^Ironforge^Royal Historian Archesonus^Royal Historian Archesonus^The Smoldering Ruins of Thaurissan^^Kharan Mighthammer^Venture to the Ruins of Thaurissan in the Burning Steppes and recover information from the Thaurissan Relics. Return to Royal Historian Archesonus when you have recovered the information.^Venture to the smoldering ruins of Thaurissan in the Burning Steppes and gather as much information as possible. It is said that mysterious relics litter the ruins. Perhaps you should start your search there
column2: <name>. Beware the Thaurissan guardians: Assassins that guard the ruins
column3: keeping whatever secrets may still be buried there protected.

column1: The Smoldering Ruins of Thaurissan^54^Alliance^Ironforge^Royal Historian Archesonus^Royal Historian Archesonus^The Smoldering Ruins of Thaurissan^^^Listen to Royal Historian Archesonus recant the history of Thaurissan.^Would you like to hear a brief history of the Dark Iron dwarves?
Hilary's Necklace^15^All^Redridge Mountains^Shawn^Hilary^^^^Find Hilary's Necklace
column2: and return it to Hilary in Lakeshire.^My friend Hilary lost her necklace
column3: and we can't find it. We've been fishing all day right here
column4: and we looked around here already. The only thing I can think of is that it fell into the lake. Our parents don't want us to swim in the lake... my mom says there's some mean things underwater
column5: but you look like you aren't scared of mean things. Could you find it for her
column6: please?

column1: Un'Goro Soil^50^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem^Ghede^Assisting Arch Druid Runetotem^^Morrowgrain Research^Bring 20 Un'Goro Soil samples to Ghede on the Elder Rise of Thunder Bluff.^The soil of Un'Goro Crater is reportedly enriched with potent magical qualities. The Cenarion Circle wants to study this soil in large quantities; go into the wilds of Un'Goro and acquire enough of it for our continued research. The rich soil will stick out in piles from time to time
column2: and some of the beasts might have usable samples on their being. Take them all outside to Ghede; just look for the piles of dirt and the tauren barking orders. He means well
column3: just don't get him riled up though!

column1: Assisting Arch Druid Runetotem^50^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Innkeeper Pala^Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem^Assisting Arch Druid Runetotem^^Un'Goro Soil^Speak with Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem in Thunder Bluff.^Excuse me <class>
column2: but I'd like just a moment of your time if possible. The Cenarion Circle in Thunder Bluff is most interested in seasoned adventurers such as yourself to lend them aid in a vital research project. While I do not know the specifics
column3: I can inform you that none other than Hamuul Runetotem is spearheading this research. Please - if you are interested
column4: speak with him directly on the Elder Rise within Thunder Bluff proper.

column1: Assisting Arch Druid Staghelm^50^Alliance^Darnassus^Innkeeper Saelienne^Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm^Assisting Arch Druid Staghelm^^^Speak with Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm in Darnassus.^Excuse me <class>
column2: but I'd like just a moment of your time if possible. The Cenarion Circle in Darnassus is looking for seasoned adventurers such as yourself to lend them aid in a vital research project. While I do not know the specifics
column3: I can inform you that none other than Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm is spearheading this research. Please - if you are interested
column4: speak with him directly in the Cenarion Enclave within Darnassus proper.

column1: Un'Goro Soil^50^Alliance^Darnassus^Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm^Jenal^Assisting Arch Druid Staghelm^^Morrowgrain Research^Bring 20 Un'Goro Soil samples to Jenal at the Cenarion Enclave in Darnassus.^The soil of Un'Goro Crater is reportedly enriched with potent magical qualities. I want to know facts from falsehoods; go into the wilds of Un'Goro and acquire enough quality samples of soil for our continued study. You may think that collection tasks are beneath you; that sort of attitude does not endear yourself to me or the Cenarion Circle. Bring the samples to Jenal
column2: who is no doubt wasting time outside behind this tree; just look for the piles of dirt. He will handle the logistics - not I.

column1: The Corruption Abroad^24^Alliance^Stormwind City^Argos Nightwhisper^Gershala Nightwhisper^The Corruption Abroad^^^Travel to Gershala Nightwhisper in Auberdine.^Stormwind -- such a bustling hub of activity. I have traveled from afar to seek help. Often it is heard that brave adventurers roam these city streets. My brother
column2: Gershala
column3: requires assistance in Darkshore. He resides in the seaside town of Auberdine. The journey is a long and epic one. It is for this reason that I ask the help of a seasoned <class> such as yourself.

column1: Morrowgrain Research^50^Alliance^Darnassus^Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm^Mathrengyl Bearwalker^Morrowgrain Research^Un'Goro Soil^^Take the Arch Druid's Seed Voucher to Mathrengyl Bearwalker in the Cenarion Enclave of Darnassus.^With what we call an Evergreen Pouch
column2: we have cultivated Tharlendris seeds in the soil from Un'Goro Crater. These seeds blossom into an array of random
column3: potent herbs. One result is morrowgrain
column4: a mysterious herb we know little about; I intend to unravel this mystery. Take this to Mathrengyl downstairs
column5: and he will give you some seeds so you can get started. If you run out
column6: you will need to purchase more from him.

column1: Morrowgrain Research^50^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem^Bashana Runetotem^Morrowgrain Research^Un'Goro Soil^^Take the Seed Voucher to Bashana Runetotem in Thunder Bluff.^With what we call an Evergreen Pouch
column2: we have cultivated Tharlendris seeds in the soil from Un'Goro Crater. These seeds have blossomed into an array of random
column3: potent herbs. One result is morrowgrain
column4: a mysterious herb we know little about; I very much hope to unravel this mystery for the Circle. Take this voucher over to my daughter Bashana
column5: and she will give you some seeds so you may assist us. If you run out
column6: you will need to purchase more from her.

column1: Are We There
column2: Yeti?^56^All^Winterspring^Umi Rumplesnicker^Umi Rumplesnicker^Are We There
column3: Yeti?^^^Collect 10 Thick Yeti Furs for Umi Rumplesnicker in Everlook.^My friends are always coming up with great ideas. I've never felt like I could match them... until today! I just drew up the plans for something great! If you promise not to tell
column4: I'll let you in on the secret... I'm going to make a mechanical yeti! Not only are my friends sure to be freaked out when they see it
column5: but when they get over that
column6: I know they'll be impressed! I need thick yeti fur from the ice thistle yeti to start with. Will you help? You'll find them to the southeast.

column1: Assisting Arch Druid Runetotem^50^Horde^Undercity^Innkeeper Norman^Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem^Assisting Arch Druid Runetotem^^Un'Goro Soil^Speak with Arch Druid Hamuul Runetotem in Thunder Bluff.^Excuse me <class>
column2: but I'd like just a moment of your time if possible. The Cenarion Circle in Thunder Bluff is most interested in seasoned adventurers such as yourself to lend them aid in a vital research project. While I do not know the specifics
column3: I can inform you that none other than Hamuul Runetotem is spearheading this research. Please - if you are interested
column4: speak with him directly on the Elder Rise within Thunder Bluff proper.

column1: Morrowgrain Research^50^Alliance^Darnassus^Mathrengyl Bearwalker^Mathrengyl Bearwalker^Morrowgrain Research^^Jonespyre's Request
column2: Jonespyre's Request
column3: Morrowgrain to Darnassus^Use an Evergreen Pouch with a Packet of Tharlendis Seeds and two Un'Goro Soil samples to try and cultivate samples of Morrowgrain.^Here's your Evergreen Pouch that you'll need to use the Tharlendis seeds with. You also need to have Un'Goro soil samples on hand to use as fertilizer for the seeds. Just use the pouch when you have everything; the pouch will take care of the rest. When you have enough morrowgrain
column4: bring them here to me in the enclave. Please don't bother the Arch Druid; he's a very busy man
column5: and he doesn't need to be disturbed every time someone returns with another batch of morrowgrain!

column1: Morrowgrain Research^50^Horde^Thunder Bluff^Bashana Runetotem^Bashana Runetotem^Morrowgrain Research^^Morrowgrain to Thunder Bluff^Use an Evergreen Pouch with a Packet of Tharlendis Seeds and two Un'Goro Soil samples to try and cultivate samples of Morrowgrain.^Here's your Evergreen Pouch that you'll need to use the Tharlendis seeds with. You also need to have Un'Goro soil samples on hand to use as fertilizer for the seeds. Just use the pouch when you have everything; the pouch will take care of the rest. When you have enough morrowgrain
column2: bring them to me here on Elder Rise. Please don't bother the Arch Druid; he'll be very busy with the research
column3: as well as the multitude of concerns he has!

column1: Jonespyre's Request^50^All^Stormwind City^Tannysa^Quintis Jonespyre^Jonespyre's Request^Morrowgrain Research^^Speak with Quintis Jonespyre in Feathermoon Stronghold.^Excuse me
column2: friend... A colleague of mine would like to speak with you about the research you are doing in conjunction with the Cenarion Circle. He is a druid by the name of Quintis Jonespyre
column3: and he resides in Feathermoon Stronghold
column4: Feralas. He would like to confer with you about morrowgrain... and he very much would like for you to keep our discussion from the ears of the Arch Druid. If you're interested
column5: speak with him; no doubt
column6: all will be revealed once you do.

column1: Jonespyre's Request^50^Alliance^Feralas^Innkeeper Shyria^Quintis Jonespyre^Jonespyre's Request^Morrowgrain Research^^Speak with Quintis Jonespyre in Feathermoon Stronghold.^Excuse me
column2: friend... A colleague of mine would like to speak with you about the research you are doing in conjunction with the Cenarion Circle. He is a druid by the name of Quintis Jonespyre
column3: and he resides here in Feathermoon Stronghold. He would like to confer with you about morrowgrain... and he very much would like for you to keep our discussion from the ears of the Arch Druid. If you're interested
column4: speak with him; no doubt
column5: all will be revealed once you do.

column1: Assisting Arch Druid Staghelm^50^Alliance^Stormwind City^Innkeeper Allison^Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm^Assisting Arch Druid Staghelm^^^Speak with Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm in Darnassus.^Excuse me <class>
column2: but I'd like just a moment of your time if possible. The Cenarion Circle in Darnassus is looking for seasoned adventurers such as yourself to lend them aid in a vital research project. While I do not know the specifics
column3: I can inform you that none other than Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm is spearheading this research. Please - if you are interested
column4: speak with him directly in the Cenarion Enclave within Darnassus proper.

column1: Assisting Arch Druid Staghelm^50^Alliance^Ironforge^Innkeeper Firebrew^Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm^Assisting Arch Druid Staghelm^^^Speak with Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm in Darnassus.^Excuse me <class>
column2: but I'd like just a moment of your time if possible. The Cenarion Circle in Darnassus is looking for seasoned adventurers such as yourself to lend them aid in a vital research project. While I do not know the specifics
column3: I can inform you that none other than Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm is spearheading this research. Please - if you are interested
column4: speak with him directly in the Cenarion Enclave within Darnassus proper.

column1: The Mystery of Morrowgrain^50^Alliance^Feralas^Quintis Jonespyre^Quintis Jonespyre^Jonespyre's Request^^Morrowgrain to Feathermoon Stronghold^Bring 10 Morrowgrain to Quintis Jonespyre in Feathermoon Stronghold.^Let me to be frank with you
column2: <name>. I'm interested - nay
column3: concerned with why the Arch Druid in Darnassus is using the name of the Cenarion Circle as well as the Circle's resources to procure vast amounts of morrowgrain. I'm a researcher - curses are my specialty. I've heard that morrowgrain
column4: under the right conditions
column5: exude qualities like other herbs used in primitive curses. I want to know more
column6: and I ask for your help. Bring me ten morrowgrain
column7: and I will be sure to take care of you.

column1: Dark Iron Legacy^52^All^Blackrock Depths^Franclorn Forgewright^Franclorn Forgewright^Dark Iron Legacy^^^Speak with Franclorn Forgewright at Forgewright's Tomb in Blackrock Mountain if you are interested in obtaining a key to the city major.^Greetings
column2: <name>. I am Franclorn Forgewright. Yes
column3: the Franclorn Forgewright responsible for the stonewrought method of architecture. You have undoubtedly passed through or stood upon one of my creations in your adventures across our war torn world. You are probably wondering why I am here and what it is that I want from you - both valid questions. I need your assistance
column4: of course. In exchange for your assistance
column5: I shall grant you the key to the depths of my accursed city.

column1: Dark Iron Legacy^52^All^Blackrock Depths^Franclorn Forgewright^Monument of Franclorn Forgewright^Dark Iron Legacy^^^Slay Fineous Darkvire and recover the great hammer
column2: Ironfel. Take Ironfel to the Shrine of Thaurissan and place it on the statue of Franclorn Forgewright.^You will find Fineous Darkvire beyond the Ring of Law
column3: in the Hall of Crafting. Kill the miserable cur and recover Ironfel. Take Ironfel to the Shrine of Thaurissan and place the hammer in its rightful place: In the hands of the statue erected in my honor. When this is done
column4: the compartment in which I stored the master key will open. More importantly
column5: Ironfel will remain forever in my grasp. Should they make an attempt to remove the hammer; both the statue and hammer will shatter
column6: lost forever.

column1: Dreadmaul Rock^52^Horde^Badlands^Thal'trak Proudtusk^Sha'ni Proudtusk^Dreadmaul Rock^^^Venture forth to the Burning Steppes and find out what became of Sha'ni Proudtusk.^Sha'ni was sent to investigate reports of strange ritualistic activity coming from the Firegut ogres of the Burning Steppes over three weeks ago. Goretooth tells me that he hasn't heard from anyone in that platoon and that it's best that I move on and focus on the task at hand. Can you believe it? That's my wife! I can't leave my post
column2: <name>
column3: but I must know what became of Sha'ni. Travel to the Burning Steppes and search for her.

column1: Krom'Grul^53^Horde^Burning Steppes^Sha'ni Proudtusk^Thal'trak Proudtusk^Dreadmaul Rock^^^Recover Sha'ni's Nose-Ring from Krom'Grul and return it to Thal'trak in Kargath. Search the various caves and mines in Dreadmaul Rock.^My whole platoon was captured
column2: <name>. All were slain - except me. Their leader
column3: Krom'Grul
column4: wanted to save me for some sort of ritual. I was chained to this altar and brutalized by the beast. My physical being ceased functioning after an hour of this torture. The beast then ripped my wedding nose-ring off of my face and stuck it on his finger. I had never seen such savagery! Find Krom'Grul and kill him! Take my ring back to Thal'trak. And <name>
column5: tell him that we will meet again... in another life.

column1: Extinguish the Firegut^52^Alliance^Burning Steppes^Oralius^Oralius^Extinguish the Firegut^^^Slay 15 Firegut Ogre-Mages
column2: 7 Firegut Ogres
column3: and 7 Firegut Ogre Brutes.^We must strike at our enemies before they strike at us! I'll make this brief
column4: soldier. The Firegut ogres of the Burning Steppes are allies of the Blackrock orcs. They work closely with those vile orcs
column5: keeping the mineral rich Dreadmaul Rock guarded and the supply lines open at all times. Leave your mark
column6: <name>. Cripple their forces and return to me when the job is done. <Oralius grabs at the air and makes a choking motion.> I WILL KILL YOU
column7: WINKY!

column1: Gor'tesh the Brute Lord^53^Alliance^Burning Steppes^Oralius^Oralius^Extinguish the Firegut^^^Collect Gor'tesh's Lopped Off Head.^They're reeling I tell you! Our next strike must be decisive. The brute lord
column2: Gor'tesh
column3: must be slain. More importantly
column4: his head must be returned to me so that I may prepare the third phase of our attack on the Firegut ogres. Be warned
column5: soldier
column6: Gor'tesh rules not from Dreadmaul Rock but from a Blackrock orc structure to the west of Dreadmaul Rock. Your orders
column7: then
column8: are simple. Find Gor'tesh and chop off his fat head. Return to me when the job is done. SHUT UP
column9: WINKY!

column1: Ogre Head On A Stick = Party^53^Alliance^Burning Steppes^Oralius^Oralius^Extinguish the Firegut^^^Take Gor'tesh's Lopped Off Head and place it at the top of Dreadmaul Rock. Look for a soft dirt mound to plant the pike.^Just one last thing you must do
column2: soldier. I've taken the liberty of putting Gor'tesh's head on a pike. Now all you have to do is take this head to the top of Dreadmaul Rock and stick it into the ground. Once you do that
column3: watch as those cowardly ogres run for their lives! After you've had your fun
column4: come back to me and I'll reward you for all of your hard work. <Oralius seems to be losing touch with reality.>

column1: An Orphan Looking For a Home^47^Alliance^Feralas^Kindal Moonweaver^Quentin^An Orphan Looking For a Home^Doling Justice^^Speak to Quentin in Thousand Needles.^Oh
column2: hello
column3: <name>. I'm so glad to see you again. How was your trip to Darnassus? Well
column4: you'll be happy to know that we've made quite a bit of progress while you've been gone. We even saved a nest full of eggs. Unfortunately
column5: the mother died before we got to her. Say
column6: would you want one for a pet? They look to hatch soon
column7: so they'll need a good <father/mother>. What do you say? If you're really interested
column8: take one of the eggs to Quentin at the race tracks in Shimmering Flats. He'll tell you more.

column1: A Short Incubation^47^Alliance^Feralas^Quentin^Quentin^An Orphan Looking For a Home^^The Newest Member of the Family^Bring 2 Elixir of Fortitudes to Quentin in Thousand Needles.^The Moonweavers
column2: huh? Most intriguing. I wish the sprite darters could truly appreciate what it means to have those two look after them. They are both quite capable. So
column3: they gave you the egg as a gift. Well
column4: then you should be responsible for it for as long as you desire. It appears it's almost ready to hatch
column5: but we should ensure it's healthy and no damage has been done to it. I only need two elixirs of fortitude for a small spell to protect the egg. I have the rest of the components here with me.

column1: The Newest Member of the Family^47^Alliance^Feralas^Quentin^Agnar Beastamer^The Newest Member of the Family^A Short Incubation^^Take your Fragile Sprite Darter Egg to the Hinterlands and speak to Agnar Beastamer
column2: but hurry
column3: you only have 1 hour to find him before the hatchling within the egg dies.^A magnificent specimen
column4: <name>. If this creature survives gestation
column5: then it'll be a healthy pet indeed! There is one last thing I would suggest doing if you plan on following through with this--head to Aerie Peak in the Hinterlands. Speak to a dwarf there named Agnar Beastamer
column6: he's a master animal handler and should be able to guide you in the final steps of incubation. But hurry
column7: <name>
column8: this egg is fragile and will not last long without proper care.

column1: It's a Secret to Everybody^52^All^Un'Goro Crater^A Wrecked Raft^A Small Pack^It's a Secret to Everybody^^^Look around in the pond for a clue about who this wrecked raft may belong to.^A destroyed raft rests along the shoreline. Considering this is only a small pond
column2: it is not clear as to how it ended up here
column3: although looking at the trees tells you that the water level may not be constant. Perhaps a little exploration in the area might uncover more clues...

column1: It's a Secret to Everybody^52^All^Un'Goro Crater^A Small Pack^Linken^It's a Secret to Everybody^^^Examine the items inside the pack and bring them to their owner.^Grabbing onto it
column2: you pull the pack back to the shore. Perhaps if you examine the items inside the pack
column3: you might find out more about who it belongs to. There are a few stray travelers at Marshal's Refuge. Perhaps you might find out more there.

column1: Expedition Salvation^53^All^Un'Goro Crater^Williden Marshal^Williden Marshal^^^^Bring a Crate of Foodstuffs and Research Equipment to Williden Marshal in Un'Goro Crater.^I don't know how you made it here
column2: but you're a sight for sore eyes! I'm Williden Marshal
column3: and I lead a non-aligned expedition troupe. Our latest and greatest endeavor has met with what seems like countless disasters
column4: the most serious of which being that we underestimated the savagery of Un'Goro Crater! As we fled our base camps in the southwestern and northeastern parts of the crater
column5: we left behind vital supplies. You look like you're capable enough - can you help us by getting them back?

column1: Roll the Bones^51^All^Un'Goro Crater^Spark Nilminer^Spark Nilminer^^^^Bring 8 Dinosaur Bones to Spark Nilminer in Un'Goro Crater.^You'd think that being chief digger for Marshal Expeditions means I like digging. There might be worse things to do in this world... but none really leap to mind. We were supposed to be digging in Terror Run - FANTASTIC name by the way - for dead stegodons and diemetradons. Well
column2: there are plenty of live ones there too! Wil and Hol are still all about studying this death trap
column3: so we need those dinosaur bones. Between you and me though
column4: bringing some from live ones will work out just as well.

column1: Alien Ecology^52^All^Un'Goro Crater^Hol'anyee Marshal^Hol'anyee Marshal^^^^Use the Scraping Vial to collect a Hive Wall Sample from one of the Gorishi hive hatcheries in Un'Goro Crater. Look for the chambers with the hanging larval spawns.^Just because we've suffered a setback doesn't mean that research must stop! We were investigating the Gorishi insects in the southern part of the crater before winding up here. Their presence is alien to the ecology of Un'Goro
column2: and we want to find out why. In their hive network must be larval hatcheries. You can identify these places by their hanging larval spawns. Use this vial to take a sample of the hive wall near any of the hatcheries. Bring it back to me for study
column3: but be careful!

column1: Williden's Journal^50^All^Un'Goro Crater^A Mangled Journal^Williden Marshal^^^^Return the journal to Williden Marshal somewhere in Un'Goro Crater.^You have uncovered a mangled journal. Parts of it remain legible
column2: with a Williden Marshal claiming ownership over the contents therein. If the journal is accurate
column3: then Williden may be found somewhere in the northern part of the Crater; according to the journal
column4: he and his companions sought higher ground from the savage beasts of the Crater once their base camps were overrun.

column1: Rattling the Rattlecages^3^All^Tirisfal Glades^Shadow Priest Sarvis^Shadow Priest Sarvis^^The Mindless Ones^^Kill 8 Rattlecage Skeletons
column2: and then return to Shadow Priest Sarvis in Deathknell when you are done.^You've shown your potential to the Forsaken under normal circumstances <name> - now let's see you under pressure. The Rattlecage skeletons
column3: more mindless minions of the Lich King
column4: are a tougher foe than the zombies you have faced thus far. Again
column5: thin their numbers and prove yourself to the Forsaken. Do not tarry - when you are done
column6: speak to me again.

column1: Scavenging Deathknell^3^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Deathguard Saltain^Deathguard Saltain^^The Damned^^Search Deathknell and the vicinity for 6 pieces of Scavenged Goods
column2: and return them to Deathguard Saltain.^You there! If you're looking for something to make yourself useful
column3: then listen up! We need fresh out-of-the-ground recruits to head into Deathknell and search for any sort of useful equipment. Most likely
column4: they'll be in stacks of boxes. We expect more recruits to be rising soon
column5: and unless we want them to stumble about naked we had better get to scavenging! Well get to work
column6: you miserable bag of bones! I'm not going to reward those without some hustle.

column1: Milly Osworth^4^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Deputy Willem^Milly Osworth^Milly Osworth^Wolves Across the Border^^Speak with Milly Osworth.^You've shown yourself a dependable <class>
column2: <name>. Dependable
column3: and not afraid to get your hands dirty
column4: eh? I have a friend
column5: Milly Osworth
column6: who's in some trouble. She's over with her wagon on the other side of the abbey
column7: near the stable. I'm sure she could use a pair of hands like yours.

column1: Milly's Harvest^4^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Milly Osworth^Milly Osworth^Milly Osworth^^Grape Manifest^Bring 8 crates of Milly's Harvest to Milly Osworth at Northshire Abbey.^A gang of brigands
column2: the Defias
column3: moved into the Northshire Vineyards while I was harvesting! I reported it to the Northshire guards and they assured me they'd take care of things
column4: but... I'm afraid for my crop of grapes! If the Defias don't steal them then I fear our guards will trample them when they chase away the thugs. Please
column5: you must help me! I gathered most of my grapes into buckets
column6: but I left them in the vineyards to the southeast. Bring me those buckets! Save my harvest!

column1: Grape Manifest^4^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Milly Osworth^Brother Neals^^Milly's Harvest^^Bring the Grape Manifest to Brother Neals in Northshire Abbey.^Now that my crop is saved
column2: take this Grape Manifest to Brother Neals. He manages the store of food and drink in Northshire
column3: and I'm sure he'll be delighted to hear that he has fresh grapes. You'll find Brother Neals in the abbey
column4: in the bell tower... where he likes to taste his wine.

column1: Disharmony of Flame^52^Horde^Blackrock Mountain^Thunderheart^Thunderheart^Disharmony of Flame^^Commander Gor'shak
column2: The Last Element^Travel to the quarry in Blackrock Mountain and slay Overmaster Pyron. Return to Thunderheart when you have completed this assignment.^The elders have felt a disturbance amongst the elements. The Dark Iron dwarves have summoned a foul spirit into our world that threatens to plague our lands with an eternal draught. This disharmony of flame must be investigated. Travel to Blackrock Mountain
column3: through the Chasm of Flame
column4: into the quarry. It is there that you shall find this lord of fire: Overmaster Pyron. End the disruption and return to me.

column1: Disharmony of Fire^56^Horde^Blackrock Depths^Thunderheart^Thunderheart^Disharmony of Flame^^^Enter Blackrock Depths and track down Lord Incendius. Slay him and return any source of information you may find to Thunderheart.^I can taste the foulness in the air that surrounds you
column2: <name>. There is another
column3: hidden in the depths of Blackrock
column4: who does control this foulness. The wind and earth cry his name: Lord Incendius... but someone... something... commands this being. He is merely an emissary. Find him and discover where his master hides. Return to me when you have collected this information.

column1: It's a Secret to Everybody^52^All^Un'Goro Crater^Linken^Donova Snowden^It's a Secret to Everybody^^The Videre Elixir^Take Linken's Sword to Donova Snowden in Winterspring.^You see
column2: I have no idea how I ended up here. No one really knows -- it's a secret to everybody! I just can't seem to remember anything... These items you brought to me
column3: though... I am remembering something. My sword. I am supposed to strengthen it somehow
column4: but I'm really not sure why. Sorry I can't tell you more
column5: but I just don't remember! Anyhoo
column6: I do know where you can take it -- Donova Snowden in Winterspring. You'll find her by the hot springs. She can temper the sword by the pools there.

column1: The Videre Elixir^52^All^Un'Goro Crater^Donova Snowden^Donova Snowden^The Videre Elixir^It's a Secret to Everybody^^Seek out Gregan Brewspewer in northern Feralas. From him
column2: learn how you may acquire the Videre Elixir
column3: then return to Donova Snowden in Winterspring.^Now
column4: what's this? Linken... FORGOT? Oh
column5: I see... Lost his memory... Well
column6: here is his sword. It's not complete
column7: though. I know of the one that can finish it
column8: but... speaking with him may prove difficult. Listen
column9: I know of someone that will be able to help you. It's too much to explain right now
column10: but you must somehow acquire a Videre Elixir. The only one I know that can help you with that is Gregan Brewspewer. He's hard to track down
column11: but last I knew he was camping in the wilds of Feralas.

column1: Meet at the Grave^52^All^Un'Goro Crater^Donova Snowden^Gaeriyan^The Videre Elixir^^^Go to the graveyard outside Gadgetzan
column2: and use the Videre Elixir. Follow the rest of Donova's instructions to find Gaeriyan.^This elixir will allow you to speak with one that you would not normally even see... Take the Videre elixir
column3: along with Linken's sword
column4: to the graveyard just outside Gadgetzan in Tanaris. Once there
column5: drink the potion. You may be quite surprised at the results
column6: but do not be alarmed. In your "other" form
column7: head due north until you reach the mountains. You'll find the one you need to speak with in one of the rocky crevices. His name is Gaeriyan. Remember
column8: he will only speak to you in that form...

column1: A Grave Situation^52^All^Un'Goro Crater^Gaeriyan^A Conspicuous Gravestone^The Videre Elixir^^^Resurrect
column2: then look for the gravestone that Gaeriyan told you to find.^If you return to the graveyard
column3: <name>
column4: you will find a gravestone there... Not just any gravestone; this one will stand out from the others. Secrets lie within it. Push on the stone
column5: and you will learn of these secrets...

column1: Linken's Sword^52^All^Un'Goro Crater^A Conspicuous Gravestone^Linken^The Videre Elixir^^^Deliver Linken's Superior Sword to Linken in Un'Goro Crater.^After a strong flash of light
column2: you are able to pick up the sword again. It has been transformed!

column1: Wenikee Boltbucket^14^Horde^The Barrens^Sputtervalve^Wenikee Boltbucket^Wenikee Boltbucket^Samophlange^^Bring the Broken Samophlange to Wenikee Boltbucket.^I think I might have broken that Samophlange. That's not good
column2: because I already told some colleagues in Undermine about it and they were very intrigued. We must find a way to fix it! Take the broken samophlange to Wenikee Boltbucket
column3: just south of Mor'shan Rampart
column4: the horde outpost between the Barrens and Ashenvale. She is very clever and inquisitive. If you show her the samophlange I bet she'd jump at the chance to fix it.

column1: Nugget Slugs^15^Horde^The Barrens^Wenikee Boltbucket^Wenikee Boltbucket^Wenikee Boltbucket^^Rilli Greasygob^Bring 15 Nugget Slugs to Wenikee Boltbucket in the Barrens.^I want to fix this samophlange
