column2: but to do that I'm going to need some supplies. I ran out of seventeen-point-five gauge nugget slugs and I'm going to need a bunch of those for the work ahead. The closest place to get them is the Sludge Fen to the east. The Venture Company usually keeps them in their tool buckets. Go to the Sludge Fen and look in the tool buckets you find there
column3: then return to me when you've gathered enough nugget slugs.

column1: Rilli Greasygob^18^Horde^The Barrens^Wenikee Boltbucket^Rilli Greasygob^Rilli Greasygob^Nugget Slugs^^Bring the Broken and Battered Samophlange to Rilli Greasygob in Orgrimmar.^Well
column2: that didn't work. I put some extra gauges on the samophlange to measure its structural integrity
column3: and they read the integrity at an all-time low. I could add some more dials and maybe a lever or two to try and fix it
column4: but... I think that might make things even worse. You should take the samophlange to Rilli Greasygob. He used to work for the Venture Company -- if anyone knows how to fix it
column5: it's Rilli. You can find him at Nogg's Machine Shop in Orgrimmar
column6: in the Valley of Honor.

column1: Samophlange Manual^19^Horde^The Barrens^Rilli Greasygob^Rilli Greasygob^Rilli Greasygob^^^Bring the Samophlange Manual to Rilli Greasygob in Orgrimmar.^I think I can fix the samophlange
column2: but I'm going to need the user's manual first. When I was in the Venture Company I had a rival
column3: Boss Copperplug
column4: who hoarded the secrets of the samophlange
column5: giving out small bits of knowledge on the device to those he trusted. I wasn't one of the trusted few... Boss Copperplug used to stay at the Boulder Lode Mine in northeastern Barrens. Get the manual from him
column6: and if he's given pages from it to anyone
column7: you'll have to collect them too.

column1: A Gnome's Assistance^52^All^Un'Goro Crater^Linken^J.D. Collie^The Videre Elixir^^Linken's Memory^Find J.D. Collie in the cave at Marshal's Refuge.^Thinking... Thinking... I know I came here for something important... I have an idea
column2: <name>. In the cave over there is a gnome named J.D. that was very kind to me when I first arrived here. Perhaps in my disoriented state
column3: I might have mentioned something to her. Why don't you go ask her if she knows anything? Oh
column4: but be careful -- she's always messing with those crazy glowing crystals I've seen in the crater. I'm not quite sure what she's up to in there!

column1: Linken's Memory^54^All^Un'Goro Crater^J.D. Collie^Eridan Bluewind^Linken's Memory^A Gnome's Assistance^^Find Eridan Bluewind in southern Felwood.^Oh... Linken? Yeah
column2: he's a funny one. When he first got here
column3: he was mumbling about all kinds of strange things. Probably got bumped on the head pretty hard
column4: I imagine. Something he said kinda stuck with me though -- that he was making some sort of totem; said he had to talk to someone named Eridan Bluewind... in a place called Felwood
column5: I think? I doubt he could tell you much now
column6: though. If you want to know more
column7: maybe you should look for Eridan yourself?

column1: Linken's Adventure^54^All^Un'Goro Crater^J.D. Collie^Linken^Linken's Adventure^Aquementas^^Take the Silver Totem of Aquementas to Linken in Marshal's Refuge.^To think all this time that the reason Linken came here was to rid us of Blazerunner... He seems like such an ordinary guy
column2: but I did notice that he's not at all interested in any of my experiments or gadgets like most gnomes would be. He must be a true warrior at heart. Bring the totem to him. See if that helps him remember why he came here.

column1: It's Dangerous to Go Alone^56^All^Un'Goro Crater^Linken^Linken^Linken's Adventure^^^Travel to Fire Plume Ridge
column2: south of Marshal's Refuge.^<name>
column3: I finally remember now... I did come here to fight Blazerunner. I was on a journey
column4: and this was to be the last step. But I am no longer the hero... You are. All that you have done -- you must finish this now
column5: not me. Blazerunner guards an artifact called the Golden Flame. It provides power more vast than anything else I have ever known
column6: and it is dangerous in the hands of one with an evil heart. You will want to bring others with you -- it's dangerous to go alone. Take this as my advice.

column1: Commander Gor'shak^52^Horde^Blackrock Depths^Galamav the Marksman^Commander Gor'shak^Commander Gor'shak^Disharmony of Flame^^Find Commander Gor'shak in Blackrock Depths.^Poor Gargal... didn't even see it coming. WHAM! The arrow landed dead center on the top of his head. He was no genius before but now... <Galamav grimaces.> When we dislodged the arrow
column2: we noticed a rolled up note attached to the shaft. On the note was a crudely drawn picture of an orc behind bars with the signature of Commander Gor'shak attached. If he's still alive in the Depths
column3: you'll have to find him. A trap you say? Well no kidding
column4: numb hooves! That's why you're going!

column1: What Is Going On?^54^Horde^Blackrock Depths^Commander Gor'shak^Commander Gor'shak^Commander Gor'shak^^^Defend Gor'shak.^I was sent here under the auspices of Thrall. Do you actually think these buffoons could capture me? I allowed myself to be captured so that I could gather intelligence. <Gor'shak whispers.> The Princess of Ironforge has been kidnapped by Emperor Thaurissan. Princess Bronzebeard is in this very city! I bet old Magni's heart almost stopped when he heard that news. <Gor'shak laughs.> Shhh! Do you hear that? Guards coming! DEFEND YOURSELF!

What Is Going On?^54^Horde^Blackrock Depths^Commander Gor'shak^Thrall^Commander Gor'shak^^^Speak with Kharan Mighthammer and gather information about Princess Moira Bronzebeard's kidnapping. Take that information to Thrall in Orgrimmar.^So far
column2: my communication with the dwarf
column3: Kharan
column4: in the cell across the hall
column5: has been limited. I have
column6: however
column7: managed to convince him that I
column8: rather -we- mean him no harm. Go speak with him and gather as much information about the Princess and her captors as possible. Take that information back to the Warchief. Thrall does not want the Princess harmed
column9: but instead
column10: has some grand plan laid out
column11: which includes her being safely returned to Ironforge. Kharan already knows all of this... Go!

column1: The Eastern Kingdoms^54^Horde^Blackrock Depths^Thrall^Thrall^Commander Gor'shak^^^Speak with Thrall if you are prepared to take on the mission he has planned.^You bring excellent information
column2: <name>. As Warchief
column3: it is my duty to do what is best for the Horde. To ensure that the generations that come after us are not forced into a hopeless existence. The opportunity to shape our future alliances has fallen into our collective laps. A move to help the dwarves could greatly strengthen our relationships in the Eastern Kingdoms. This
column4: then
column5: is why you must not fail! Are you prepared?

column1: The Royal Rescue^59^Horde^Blackrock Depths^Thrall^Princess Moira Bronzebeard^Commander Gor'shak^^^Slay Emperor Dagran Thaurissan and free Princess Moira Bronzebeard from his evil spell.^This strike against the Dark Iron dwarves
column2: if successful
column3: will send a shockwave throughout their entire kingdom. Princess Bronzebeard is under the control of Emperor Thaurissan. To free her
column4: you must kill the Emperor. Be warned
column5: your task is doubly dangerous
column6: as Bronzebeard will attack you without question while under the control of the Emperor. DO NOT HARM HER!

column1: The Princess Saved?^60^Horde^Blackrock Depths^Princess Moira Bronzebeard^Thrall^Commander Gor'shak^^^Return to Thrall at Grommash Hold in Orgrimmar.^You have slain my husband
column2: <race>! My child will be born into this world without a father. <Princess Moira points directly at you.> I assure you
column3: this child will be the next ruler of the kingdom of Ironforge. You and your kind shall be hunted down until the end of days for this wrongful act. <You think that Princess Moira may be suffering from the residual effect of Thaurissan's spell.> Leave me be
column4: <race>. I am certain your warchief will be eager to hear the results of his meddling.

column1: Aquementas^54^All^Un'Goro Crater^Eridan Bluewind^J.D. Collie^Linken's Memory^^Linken's Adventure^Take the Book of Aquor
column2: the Silvery Claws
column3: and the Irontree Heart to Tanaris.^Take this bag of supplies with you to Tanaris. Travel to Lost Rigger Cove
column4: and look for a circle of stones. The eastmost peninsula is the secret... From this circle only
column5: read from the book of Aquor; summon the only creature that can transform the items you collected into a totem to fight Blazerunner. Aquementas will not be pleased to be awakened
column6: but remember
column7: you must remain in the circle for him to transform the items.

column1: Counterattack!^20^Horde^The Barrens^Regthar Deathgate^Regthar Deathgate^^Hezrul Bloodmark^^Bring a Piece of Krom'zar's Banner to Regthar Deathgate
column2: west of the Crossroads.^The Horde commends your successes against the Kolkar
column3: but the Kolkar themselves are maddened. I have reports that a contingent of Kolkar has traveled to the Barrens from their home in Desolace
column4: to seek vengeance. My latest report was that
column5: even now
column6: they move against these bunkers
column7: from the west! Face the Kolkar invaders
column8: and end their threat in the Barrens. Kill them until their leader
column9: Warlord Krom'zar
column10: appears. Defeat him and bring me a piece of his banner as proof. We're counting on you
column11: <name>.

column1: A Taste of Flame^54^All^Burning Steppes^Cyrus Therepentous^Cyrus Therepentous^A Taste of Flame^Trinkets...^A Taste of Flame^Show Cyrus Therepentous the Black Dragonflight Molt you received from Kalaran Windblade.^The flight is aware of your work in the Searing Gorge. Show it to me
column2: <race>. The molt
column3: imbecile.

column1: A Taste of Flame^54^All^Burning Steppes^Cyrus Therepentous^Cyrus Therepentous^A Taste of Flame^^A Taste of Flame^Show Cyrus Therepentous proof of your worth.^You seek out the Flight? Present to me proof of your worth
column2: mortal.

column1: A Taste of Flame^58^All^Blackrock Depths^Cyrus Therepentous^Cyrus Therepentous^A Taste of Flame^^^Travel to Blackrock Depths and slay Bael'Gar.^I wish to taste the searing flames of the mountain of fire. To let the molten fires of Blackrock cascade across my being. That essence
column2: that searing heat
column3: it is what I crave. Bael'Gar resides in the Depths of Blackrock: A being of pure flame
column4: born of the fires of Ragnaros. Slay Bael'Gar and from his smoldering remains bring for me a piece of his inner fire. Use the molt on his remains to safely extract the inner flame. Succeed and be rewarded.

column1: The Rise of the Machines^54^Horde^Burning Steppes^Hierophant Theodora Mulvadania^Hierophant Theodora Mulvadania^The Rise of the Machines^^^Venture to the Burning Steppes and recover 10 Fractured Elemental Shards for Hierophant Theodora Mulvadania.^The machines made themselves known to us during our initial forays into the Searing Gorge. Upon further investigation we discovered that they were being imported from Burning Steppes
column2: possibly Blackrock Depths. That is what we need you for
column3: <name>. Your first task is to venture to the Burning Steppes and recover elemental shards from the rock automatons and lesser rock creations of the region. Once you have collected a sufficient amount
column4: return to me and I shall determine their source of origin.

column1: The Rise of the Machines^54^Horde^Badlands^Hierophant Theodora Mulvadania^Lotwil Veriatus^The Rise of the Machines^^^Take the Elemental Shard Sample to Lotwil Veriatus.^G.L.A. Those are the 'initials' imprinted on the elemental shards. Below the initials are a rank marking of some sort. The machinations you destroyed in the Burning Steppes were of 'Rank IV.' I assume that this is a lowly rank. Take this shard sample to Lotwil Veriatus in the camp to the east. He is a scholar of some renown in the field of elemental sciences. He may be able to assist us in our search.

The Rise of the Machines^58^Horde^Blackrock Depths^Lotwil Veriatus^Lotwil Veriatus^The Rise of the Machines^^^Find and slay Golem Lord Argelmach. Return his head to Lotwil. You will also need to collect 10 Intact Elemental Cores from the Ragereaver Golems and Warbringer Constructs protecting Argelmach. You know this because you are psychic.^This can't be Argelmach! Argelmach was killed ten years ago. How can I be sure? I was the one who killed him. He was a despicable dwarf
column2: hell-bent on twisting my life's work to meet his diabolical needs. It seems that the wicked always find a way to escape justice. If this is Argelmach's handiwork then he must be destroyed. I will need samplings of his latest creations. With the proper samples
column3: I may be able to stop this uprising. The creations guard Argelmach in Blackrock Depths.

column1: KILL ON SIGHT: Dark Iron Dwarves^52^Horde^Blackrock Depths^WANTED^Warlord Goretooth^^^KILL ON SIGHT: High Ranking Dark Iron Of^Venture to Blackrock Depths and destroy the vile aggressors!^By order of Warlord Goretooth
column2: commander of the Kargath Expeditionary Force: Any and all of General Angerforge's forces within Blackrock Depths must be annihilated. Angerforge's men are ruthless killers
column3: responsible for the mass murder of the 109th division of the Kargath Expeditionary Force. Heroes are warned to exercise extreme caution when confronting these brutes. Any person who destroys the first line of General Angerforge's forces in Blackrock Depths shall receive a tribute.

column1: KILL ON SIGHT: High Ranking Dark Iron Officials^54^Horde^Blackrock Depths^KILL ON SIGHT^Warlord Goretooth^^KILL ON SIGHT: Dark Iron Dwarves^Grark Lorkrub^Venture to Blackrock Depths and destroy the vile aggressors!^By order of Warlord Goretooth
column2: commander of the Kargath Expeditionary Force: Head of the K.E.F. reconnaissance division
column3: Grandmaster Lexlort
column4: has returned with news of the whereabouts of high ranking Dark Iron officials. Through locked gate
column5: near the heart of the city
column6: they train their forces to snuff out our men. Travel to Blackrock Depths and destroy them!

column1: KILL ON SIGHT: High Ranking Dark Iron Officials^54^Horde^Blackrock Depths^KILL ON SIGHT^Warlord Goretooth^^KILL ON SIGHT: Dark Iron Dwarves^Grark Lorkrub^Venture to Blackrock Depths and destroy the vile aggressors!^By order of Warlord Goretooth
column2: commander of the Kargath Expeditionary Force: Head of the K.E.F. reconnaissance division
column3: Grandmaster Lexlort
column4: has returned with news of the whereabouts of high ranking Dark Iron officials. Through locked gate
column5: near the heart of the city
column6: they train their forces to snuff out our men. Travel to Blackrock Depths and destroy them!

column1: Silver Heart^54^All^Un'Goro Crater^Eridan Bluewind^Eridan Bluewind^Linken's Memory^^^Collect 11 Silvery Claws and 1 Irontree Heart for Eridan Bluewind in Felwood.^I do not know the one you speak of
column2: <name>. But worry not; if your friend was on a journey to find me
column3: I do know what it was he desired. In the heart of Un'Goro Crater dwells evil of the purest form. This evil takes the shape of an elemental called Blazerunner... protected by an aura that none can dispel... None... except those with enough power to do so. I can teach you of this power
column4: <name>. First
column5: do as I ask. Collect 11 Silvery Claws and 1 Irontree Heart from the creatures in Felwood
column6: then return.

column1: Cleansing Felwood^55^Alliance^Felwood^Arathandris Silversky^Arathandris Silversky^^^Salve via Hunting
column2: Salve via Mining
column3: Salve via Gathering
column4: Salve via Skinning
column5: Salve via Disenchanting^Bring 15 Blood Amber to Arathandris Silversky in Felwood.^Plants give life to Felwood
column6: yet even they suffer the taint of corruption. I know ways to cleanse them
column7: but I cannot give out such knowledge to those I don't know or trust. Prove to me that you will truly aid the cause of the Cenarion Circle! To the north lie the Irontree Caverns. The Warpwood elementals present there are now beyond hope of cleansing. I ask you to bring me their sap - blood amber it is called - so I may study it in the hopes of saving other forms of life here.

column1: Cleansing Felwood^55^Horde^Felwood^Maybess Riverbreeze^Maybess Riverbreeze^^^Salve via Hunting
column2: Salve via Mining
column3: Salve via Gathering
column4: Salve via Skinning
column5: Salve via Disenchanting^Bring 15 Blood Amber to Maybess Riverbreeze in Felwood.^Plants give life to Felwood
column6: yet even they suffer the taint of corruption. I know ways to cleanse them
column7: but I cannot give out such knowledge to those I don't know or trust. Prove to me that you will truly aid the cause of the Cenarion Circle! To the north lie the Irontree Caverns. The Warpwood elementals present there are now beyond hope of cleansing. I ask you to bring me their sap - blood amber it is called - so I may study it in the hopes of saving other forms of life here.

column1: The Strength of Corruption^52^Horde^Feralas^Talo Thornhoof^Talo Thornhoof^^^^Talo Thornhoof at Camp Mojache in Feralas wants you to kill 12 Angerclaw Grizzlies and 12 Felpaw Ravagers in Felwood.^Being a hunter
column2: I strive to emulate the strengths I see in my opponents. It is possible to turn the battle in your favor by simply knowing your enemy well
column3: <name>. In a place called Felwood
column4: north of Ashenvale
column5: the creatures have been tainted by a substance called fel. The bears and wolves have been driven mad by it
column6: but I believe that they have also grown even stronger as well. Go
column7: <name>. Travel to Felwood and face these beasts. Learn for yourself if they are truly as strong as I believe.

column1: Precarious Predicament^58^Horde^Blackrock Depths^Grark Lorkrub^Lexlort^^Grark Lorkrub^Operation: Death to Angerforge^Escort your prisoner
column2: Grark Lorkrub
column3: through Burning Steppes and through Blackrock Mountain to the Searing Gorge.^Do you truly believe that you will make it to your rendezvous point with me in custody? You actually expected to break into a heavily fortified Blackrock fortress to capture a prized asset of theirs without alerting anyone or anything to your presence? You will be destroyed!

column1: Grark Lorkrub^58^All^Blackrock Depths^Lexlort^Grark Lorkrub^^KILL ON SIGHT: High Ranking Dark Iron Of^Precarious Predicament^Travel to the Burning Steppes and find Grark Lorkrub. You recall Lexlort mentioning that he was last seen in a massive Blackrock fortress.^I tracked him across the Searing Gorge
column2: through the mountain
column3: and into the Burning Steppes. That traitor was caught red-handed giving the Blackrock orcs vital information about our day to day operations. I'm speaking of Grark Lorkrub. He now sits in the Burning Steppes
column4: safely under their protection - or so he thinks. Take these shackles
column5: <name>. Find Grark
column6: place the shackles on him and lead him through Blackrock Mountain. Do this and a tribute is yours.

column1: The Heart of the Mountain^55^All^Blackrock Depths^Maxwort Uberglint^Maxwort Uberglint^^^^Bring the Heart of the Mountain to Maxwort Uberglint in the Burning Steppes.^For years I have sought a certain gem. It is called the Heart of the Mountain and it's the size of your fist! The Dark Iron dwarves have it locked in their vault and
column2: try as I may
column3: they won't let me purchase it. So I must resort to force. Fight your way to the Lower Vault of Blackrock Depths
column4: breach its secret safe and gain the Heart. To do that
column5: you must defeat Watchman Doomgrip
column6: and he won't appear until you've opened every relic coffer in the vault! Good luck.

column1: The Missing Courier^43^Alliance^Feralas^Latronicus Moonspear^Ginro Hearthkindle^The Missing Courier^^^Speak with Ginro Hearthkindle in Feathermoon Stronghold.^An associate of mine
column2: Ginro Hearthkindle
column3: is looking for assistance concerning the location of a courier and the parcels he was carrying. It has been a week or so since the courier went missing; our own searches have proved fruitless
column4: and we're at an impasse. Unfortunately
column5: I have had to declare the courier as missing in action. If you have the time and resources to spare
column6: please speak with Ginro. He should be here in the Stronghold - perhaps in his quarters.

column1: The Missing Courier^43^Alliance^Feralas^Ginro Hearthkindle^Wrecked Row Boat^The Missing Courier^^^Locate the courier's boat somewhere along the coast of Feralas.^It's been about a week since Raschal
column2: the courier
column3: set out for Thalanaar. He knows Feralas well; he's been with us since General Feathermoon led the expeditionary forces here. I know his plan was to take a row boat down the coast and try and traverse across southern Feralas to avoid the Horde camp. I couldn't find his boat
column4: but maybe you can. Maybe it is hidden
column5: or maybe it was sunk. Regardless
column6: it might hold a clue as to where he is. If you uncover something
column7: please let me know.

column1: Hurley Blackbreath^55^Alliance^Blackrock Depths^Ragnar Thunderbrew^Ragnar Thunderbrew^Ragnar Thunderbrew^^^Bring the Lost Thunderbrew Recipe to Ragnar Thunderbrew in Kharanos.^The Dark Iron dwarves
column2: led by the villain Hurley Blackbreath
column3: stole one of the Thunderbrew's best recipes
column4: Thunderbrew Lager. The villains! They don't deserve such a fine brew! <name>
column5: I have a tough task for you. Go to the Blackrock Depths in the Burning Steppes
column6: destroy any kegs of Thunderbrew Lager you find
column7: and bring back our recipe for Thunderbrew Lager! Please
column8: get that recipe back
column9: even if you have to turn Blackrock Depths upside down to do it!

column1: Boat Wreckage^44^Alliance^Feralas^Wrecked Row Boat^Ginro Hearthkindle^The Missing Courier^^^Return to Feathermoon Stronghold and show Ginro Hearthkindle the Discarded Knife you have found.^Running your hand along the mud
column2: your fingers graze the handle of a knife. It looks well cared for
column3: and it might be safe to assume that whoever was on the boat might have lost it. Perhaps the large chunk of the missing boat might have something to do with the loss. You grab the knife
column4: remembering that Ginro Hearthkindle in the Feathermoon Stronghold instructed you to return to him with any found clues. You get the feeling
column5: however
column6: that you are not quite alone in the water...

column1: Ragnar Thunderbrew^55^Alliance^Blackrock Depths^Enohar Thunderbrew^Ragnar Thunderbrew^Ragnar Thunderbrew^^^Speak with Ragnar Thunderbrew.^Ho
column2: <name>. I heard that Ragnar Thunderbrew is steaming mad about someone stealing his ale. He's looking for stalwart adventurers
column3: and willing to pay plenty. Talk to Ragnar if you're interested. He's at the Thunderbrew Distillery in Kharanos
column4: in Dun Morogh.

column1: The Knife Revealed^44^Alliance^Feralas^Ginro Hearthkindle^Quintis Jonespyre^The Missing Courier^^Psychometric Reading^Take the Discarded Knife to Quintis Jonespyre in Feathermoon Stronghold.^The Stronghold's resident druid
column2: Quintis Jonespyre
column3: has some... unusual skills. One of them involves psychometry - the ability to reveal an item's history by touch. Don't ask me how he does it; I chalk it up to magic I do not and choose not to understand. I do know
column4: however
column5: two things: one
column6: I've seen it work and two
column7: the bum owes me. Take the knife up to Quint in his little tree-house here
column8: and tell him for me that his Kalimdor Hold 'Em debt will be paid if he works his mojo on that knife.

column1: Psychometric Reading^44^Alliance^Feralas^Quintis Jonespyre^Ginro Hearthkindle^Psychometric Reading^The Knife Revealed^^Speak with Ginro Hearthkindle in Feathermoon Stronghold.^I'm a little wobbly still
column2: sorry. Anyway
column3: I received some useful visions. Raschal takes two large leather backpacks from his boat and goes inland; he returns to the boat
column4: however. I see gnoll scalps... he ran into some gnolls - Woodpaw I think they're called. He's very worried - almost terrified - about something. So much so
column5: that he is not paying attention to water elementals forming behind him. The images... stop there. I need to rest
column6: sorry <name>. Tell Gin what I've seen. He needs to know.

column1: The Woodpaw Gnolls^44^Alliance^Feralas^Ginro Hearthkindle^Large Leather Backpacks^Psychometric Reading^^^Search the Woodpaw Gnoll camps of southern Feralas for evidence of the courier's belongings or the courier himself.^Our "friends" the Woodpaw might have gotten Raschal in the end
column2: but something tells me that's not what occurred. Still
column3: they're the best place to start looking. I wish I had clearer insight as to what to do
column4: but all I have right now is 'Search the Woodpaw camps - go.' I do know that gnolls will keep items they scavenge and fight over them; maybe they ran across the backpacks Quint mentioned. I hadn't risked a head-on fight in past searches
column5: but with Quint's vision on this I say rip into them.

column1: Operation: Death to Angerforge^58^Horde^Blackrock Depths^Warlord Goretooth^Warlord Goretooth^^Precarious Predicament^^Travel to Blackrock Depths and slay General Angerforge! Return to Warlord Goretooth when the task is complete.^You have done an exemplary job
column2: <name>. It is now time to send you on your last mission. General Angerforge
column3: the Dark Iron responsible for coordinating the attacks on the 109th division of the K.E.F. and the mass slaughter of our forces must be brought to justice. This will undoubtedly be your most grueling mission
column4: but should you succeed
column5: you will be richly rewarded.

column1: Vivian Lagrave^55^All^Blackrock Depths^Apothecary Zinge^Shadowmage Vivian Lagrave^Vivian Lagrave^^^Speak with Shadowmaster Vivian Lagrave in Kargath.^Shadowmaster Vivian Lagrave is in need of your services. She is in the Badlands
column2: in the orcish outpost of Kargath
column3: pursuing rumors of a certain brew made by the Dark Iron dwarves of Blackrock Depths. Speak with Vivian. She awaits you.

column1: Lost Thunderbrew Recipe^55^All^Blackrock Depths^Shadowmage Vivian Lagrave^Shadowmage Vivian Lagrave^Vivian Lagrave^^^Bring the Lost Thunderbrew Recipe to Vivian Lagrave in Kargath.^It is rumored that the Dark Iron Hurley Blackbreath has stolen a recipe for ale. This ale
column2: Thunderbrew Lager
column3: is said to infuse its imbiber with great strength and courage. We wish to study the drink. Perhaps
column4: we will find other applications for its virtues... applications more in line with Forsaken objectives. Delve into Blackrock Depths
column5: find Hurley
column6: take from him the recipe for Thunderbrew lager and bring it to me. And to find him
column7: you may have to entice him by threatening his precious ale.

column1: The Writhing Deep^46^Alliance^Feralas^Large Leather Backpacks^Zukk'ash Pod^Psychometric Reading^^^Now that Raschal's last known whereabouts have been discovered
column2: continue your search for him or his remains in the Writhing Deep. According to the note
column3: it is located to the south of the Woodpaw gnoll camps.^Inside the backpacks are two items: the first is a parcel of goods that was bound for Thalanaar
column4: and the second is a note hastily penned to an unknown reader. The note tells of discovering insidious bug-like creatures south of the gnoll camps in a place called the Writhing Deep. The author felt the need to investigate it personally
column5: as though it was a serious threat to all of Feralas. The note is signed
column6: "Raschal of Feathermoon". It would seem that you have located where Raschal ultimately went.

column1: Ribbly Screwspigot^53^All^Blackrock Depths^Yuka Screwspigot^Yuka Screwspigot^Yuka Screwspigot^^^Bring Ribbly's Head to Yuka Screwspigot in the Burning Steppes.^My brother Ribbly has always been a drain to his family
column2: taking our money and wasting it on one scheme after another. Well
column3: his last scheme must have been his worst
column4: because Baron Revilgaz of Booty Bay just put a price on poor Ribbly's head. I can't tell you how happy this makes the Screwspigots! Our little Ribbly's finally worth something! But now he's hiding out
column5: deep in Blackrock Depths. Please
column6: find him and bring him to me! Or
column7: if he won't come
column8: then that's ok... just bring me his head.

column1: Muigin and Larion^52^Alliance^Un'Goro Crater^Muigin^Muigin^Muigin and Larion^^^Collect 15 Bloodpetals and return to Muigin.^See Larion over there? It's HIS fault we're here! I told him we were going the wrong way
column2: but would he listen? And would you believe that he's the one that won't speak to me? Well
column3: until he changes his mind
column4: let's have a bit of fun with him. Have you noticed the strange plant-like creatures around here? They're nothing but trouble
column5: really
column6: but I think if trained properly
column7: I could get them to obey commands. First thing though
column8: I'll need some samples to study. Do you think you could collect some?

column1: A Visit to Gregan^52^Alliance^Un'Goro Crater^Muigin^Gregan Brewspewer^Muigin and Larion^^^Take a Bloodpetal to Gregan Brewspewer in Feralas.^I'm not quite sure what to make of this
column2: <name>. The plants... they seem to have some minimal intelligence. I'm no expert
column3: though. But
column4: I do know someone that is! Head to northern Feralas
column5: and look for a buddy of mine named Gregan Brewspewer. He's an expert on this sort of thing. I'm sure Gregan can help us out here. You'll find him out in the wilderness; he's not the type to live in a big city.

column1: Haze of Evil^52^Alliance^Un'Goro Crater^Gregan Brewspewer^Muigin^Muigin and Larion^^Bloodpetal Sprouts^Collect 5 samples of Atal'ai Haze
column2: then return to Muigin in Un'Goro Crater.^To tell you the truth
column3: <name>
column4: I've never seen any plants like this in my travels. Perhaps I should take a trip to this crater... At any rate
column5: I think I know just the thing Muigin's looking for -- Atal'ai haze. It's horrid stuff
column6: hard to collect
column7: but it's just what he needs to control the little monsters. You'll need to visit the temple of Atal'Hakkar in the Swamp of Sorrows. The Atal'ai Haze can be collected from the deep lurkers
column8: murk worms
column9: or oozes found there. Good luck
column10: <name>!

column1: Larion and Muigin^52^Horde^Un'Goro Crater^Larion^Larion^Larion and Muigin^^^Hunt 5 Bloodpetal Lashers
column2: 5 Bloodpetal Threshers
column3: 5 Bloodpetal Flayers and 5 Bloodpetal Trappers for Larion at Marshal's Refuge.^See Muigin over there? It's HIS fault we're lost! I'm the one that knew the way
column4: but he insisted he knew a shortcut
column5: and we ended up here! To make matters worse
column6: now he keeps sending his crazy plant pests to annoy me. I'm so angry that I'm not planning on talking to him any time soon
column7: but these pests are too much to handle. Why don't we try to limit his supply
column8: first thing. Go out and hunt some Bloodpetals
column9: then return to me.

column1: Zapper Fuel^52^Horde^Un'Goro Crater^Liv Rizzlefix^Larion^Larion and Muigin^^Bloodpetal Zapper^Deliver the Unloaded Zapper and 5 samples of Atal'ai Haze to Larion in Marshal's Refuge.^You're in luck
column2: <name>! I've been working on some of my own experiments while Marvon's been gone
column3: and one of them is a short range bug zapper. With just a few adjustments
column4: it should be great for ridding yourself of those Bloodpetal pests. I can let you have one of my zapper prototypes
column5: but you'll still need to collect the fuel. You can get the necessary Atal'ai haze that the zapper needs in the temple of Atal'Hakkar. The deep lurkers
column6: murk worms
column7: or oozes are the ones you'll need to get it from.

column1: Marvon's Workshop^52^Horde^Un'Goro Crater^Larion^Liv Rizzlefix^Larion and Muigin^^^Travel to Marvon Rivetseeker's workshop in Ratchet.^I managed to spy on what Muigin was doing
column2: and he's actually growing the darn things over there! I think the only solution here is to... no
column3: not go talk to him... What are you thinking? The solution is to fight back! We'll need the help of my friend
column4: Marvon
column5: who has a workshop in Ratchet. I'm sure he'll be able to create some sort of gadget that will help us.

column1: Recipe of the Kaldorei^7^All^Cooking^Zarrin^Zarrin^^^^Collect 7 Small Spider Legs for Zarrin in Dolanaar.^Long ago
column2: the night elves were called the kaldorei
column3: a name that means "children of the stars." Learning of the past is an important step in your path as a <class>
column4: <name>
column5: so listen well to what I have to tell you. The kaldorei have always taken much pride in their harmonious relationship with nature. This means that we only take from nature what is necessary
column6: and that we return in kind. This balance has afforded us much
column7: <name>. Go out and collect seven small spider legs -- no more than that
column8: and return to me.

column1: Goblin Engineering^10^Alliance^Engineering^Lilliam Sparkspindle^Nixx Sprocketspring^^^The Pledge of Secrecy^If you wish to learn more about Goblin Engineering
column2: take the Manual of Engineering Disciplines to Nixx Sprocketspring in Gadgetzan.^Expert engineering yields two distinct disciplines: gnome and goblin. I only bother to mention goblin engineering because I'm a fair trainer. They like to make things that blow up
column3: and they rarely care what is in the way - even themselves. <name>
column4: read this manual. If you want to learn how to blow yourself up
column5: then take it to Nixx Sprocketspring in Gadgetzan. Remember - membership is permanent and prevents joining the other discipline
column6: so make sure this is what you want before finishing his task.

column1: The Love Potion^54^All^Blackrock Depths^Mistress Nagmara^Mistress Nagmara^^^^Bring 4 Gromsblood
column2: 10 Giant Silver Veins and Nagmara's Filled Vial to Mistress Nagmara in Blackrock Depths.^Oh
column3: the pains of love! My dear Private Rocknot is immune to my charms. I am spurned! It's maddening! You must help me! We succubi know much of love
column4: and I can make a potion to beat down the iron walls around Rocknot's heart. To make it
column5: I need these items: the herb gromsblood
column6: giant silver veins from the cliff giants of Azshara
column7: and water from the Golakka Springs Crater in Un'Goro. You can place the water in this vial. Please
column8: <name>
column9: help a poor soul in her quest for happiness!

column1: Chasing A-Me 01^53^All^Un'Goro Crater^Karna Remtravel^A-Me 01^Chasing A-Me 01^^^Find A-Me 01 in Un'Goro Crater.^Unfortunately
column2: something's happened to one of my greatest inventions. You've seen mechanical squirrels
column3: yes? Well
column4: to get closer to the apes of Un'Goro Crater
column5: I created a mechanical ape to blend in with their kind--I call her A-Me 01. She has scrying gems for eyes so I could see everything she saw. She made it to Fungal Rock--the apes' lair--just east of here
column6: and that's when I lost contact. The last thing I saw was one of their alpha males rushing up to say hello to her! Can you help me find her?

column1: Chasing A-Me 01^53^All^Un'Goro Crater^A-Me 01^A-Me 01^Chasing A-Me 01^^Chasing A-Me 01^Find a Mithril Casing and return to A-Me 01 in Un'Goro Crater.^A little further investigation shows a panel that slides open. Clearly written above some wiring is the statement
column2: "Replace Mithril Casing And Turn Power Off Then On." Taking a moment to replace the panel
column3: you wonder if it'll be that simple to fix A-Me 01 and get her back to Karna Remtravel near Marshall's Refuge. Only trying it will tell.

column1: Chasing A-Me 01^53^All^Un'Goro Crater^A-Me 01^Karna Remtravel^^Chasing A-Me 01^^Escort A-Me 01 back to Karna Remtravel in Un'Goro Crater.^Checking to see if you're prepared to lead A-Me 01 back to Karna Remtravel
column2: you flip the switch to the "Off" position. Glancing around once again to make sure none of the gorillas are coming
column3: you prepare to see what happens when you flip the switch back to the "On" position. This is your last chance... are you sure this is what you want to do?

column1: Ancient Spirit^56^Alliance^Felwood^Arei^Kayneth Stillwind^^Purified!^^Escort Arei to safety
column2: then speak with Kayneth Stillwind in Forest Song
column3: in eastern Ashenvale.^Felwood was once a peaceful and serene land... Until the legion took hold. The infernals
column4: destruction
column5: chaos... The skull of Gul'dan ensured that none were spared here. All fell to the corruption. Even now
column6: as a spirit
column7: I still find myself trapped
column8: bearing the suffering of this land. Help me find my way home. Please
column9: <name>
column10: tell me you will lead an ancient spirit away from here
column11: where I may finally rest. Once I am free
column12: seek out Kayneth Stillwind
column13: a druid that resides in Forest Song

column1: Overmaster Pyron^52^Alliance^Blackrock Mountain^Jalinda Sprig^Jalinda Sprig^Overmaster Pyron^^^Slay Overmaster Pyron.^The last five of my mages that went snooping around in Blackrock Mountain came back extra crispy with a permanent orange gnomefro - or worse. <Jalinda picks up some ashes from the ground and releases them into the air.> One nasty bugger in particular
column2: Overmaster Pyron
column3: seems to be causing quite a bit of trouble. We need that elemental terminated so that our expedition crew can make its way into Blackrock Depths! He guards the entrance at the Blackrock Quarry.

column1: Incendius!^56^Alliance^Blackrock Depths^Jalinda Sprig^Jalinda Sprig^Overmaster Pyron^^^Find Lord Incendius in Blackrock Depths and destroy him!^Are you sure Pyron said 'Incendius' when he died? <Jalinda swallows hard.> Lord Incendius is purported to be a minion of Ragnaros! Oh dear
column2: oh dear... whatever will we do? Do you think you can handle another mission? I don't have anybody else to send
column3: <name>! We will never get a team in if Incendius continues to raise Pyron from the ashes. You'll have to find and destroy Lord Incendius!

column1: Freed from the Hive^46^Alliance^Feralas^Zukk'ash Pod^Ginro Hearthkindle^Psychometric Reading^^^Free Raschal from the Zukk'ash hive.^The pod splits opens some when you touch it
column2: revealing a night elven male who is surprisingly still alive. He seems to be in good health
column3: though deeply stunned. As you help him down from the pod
column4: he stirs to life. "Thank Elune - you've saved me
column5: friend! I... I'm Raschal
column6: and I awoke paralyzed inside this pod after these bugs overwhelmed me. Were you sent by the Stronghold?" It would seem that you've found the missing courier!

column1: A Hero's Welcome^46^Alliance^Feralas^Ginro Hearthkindle^Shandris Feathermoon^Psychometric Reading^^^Speak with Shandris Feathermoon in Feathermoon Stronghold.^<name>
column2: General Shandris Feathermoon would like to speak with you personally. No doubt she wants to thank you for your service to the Stronghold
column3: but I do know that she also wants to talk to you about the insect creatures that you and Raschal faced in southern Feralas. The reports of those Zukk'ash insects are... frightening
column4: to say the least. General Feathermoon is waiting for you in the main compound.

column1: Rise of the Silithid^46^Alliance^Feralas^Shandris Feathermoon^Gracina Spiritmight^Psychometric Reading^^^Bring Raschal's Report to Gracina Spiritmight in Darnassus.^I am entrusting you with a copy of the report Raschal made on the infestation of southeastern Feralas. While the main report is being filed in Darnassus
column2: I want you to give this copy to an associate of the Protectorate. Her name is Gracina Spiritmight; she is a priestess who dwells in the Temple of the Moon in Darnassus. She has broad knowledge on these kinds of creatures
column3: and her receiving this report would benefit us all. You're dismissed - good luck
column4: <name>; may Elune watch over us all.

column1: Thalanaar Delivery^44^Alliance^Feralas^Undelivered Parcel^Falfindel Waywarder^^^^Bring the Undelivered Parcel to Falfindel Waywarder in Thalanaar.^This parcel of goods you found in the Woodpaw gnoll camps was supposed to be delivered to the small way-station of Thalanaar in southeastern Feralas. Regardless of the missing courier's fate
column2: the task of delivering the parcel remains unfinished. Examining the parcel in detail reveals a hand written name of "Falfindel Waywarder" on the outside of the packaging. Perhaps this is the parcel's ultimate recipient.

column1: FIFTY! YEP!^56^Alliance^Burning Steppes^Oralius^Oralius^^^^Collect 50 Blackrock Medallions.^I'm going to let you in on a little secret
column2: soldier. Come a little closer. I'M THE ONLY SANE ONE HERE! Look at these people! Would you believe that they're all insane!? Well they are! NUTS! CRAZY! <Oralius lowers his voice.> Let's just keep that between me
column3: you
column4: and my pal Captain Winky. <Oralius grabs at the air and squeezes.> Anyhooooo... I'm collecting badges to go along with my ogre ear collection. Orc is the flavor of the day. Fifty. GO! <Oralius blows into a horn.> SHIP IT!

column1: Crystals of Power^53^All^Un'Goro Crater^J.D. Collie^J.D. Collie^^^The Northern Pylon
column2: The Eastern Pylon
column3: The Western Pylon^Collect 7 Power Crystals of each color: red
column4: blue
column5: yellow
column6: and green. Bring them to J.D. Collie at Marshal's Refuge.^I'm sure you've noticed 'em
column7: <name>. They're everywhere! What am I talking about? Why
column8: the crystals
column9: of course! The crystals... They're all over the crater. Most people ignore them
column10: but I have a strange feeling that they hold power within them. I've been doing experiments here with them for a while
column11: but I can't seem to find anything. Well
column12: I haven't yet
column13: anyway. Say
column14: I'm running a little low on the crystals I have here -- think you might be able to collect some more for me?

column1: The Northern Pylon^53^All^Un'Goro Crater^J.D. Collie^J.D. Collie^^Crystals of Power^Making Sense of It^Discover the location of the Northern Crystal Pylon in Un'Goro Crater.^What could they be for? I can't get the thought out of my head! It's driving me crazy -- that the rumors I have heard about the crystal pylons are all true. Call me gullible
column2: but I'll usually believe anything people tell me. Anyway
column3: I have heard that there is one of the crystal pylons fairly close. Somewhere in the north... Please locate it
column4: <name>. I just know they exist.

column1: The Good Stuff^56^Alliance^Blackrock Depths^Oralius^Oralius^^^^Collect 20 Dark Iron Fanny Packs.^Captain Winky tells me that the Dark Irons in the Depths got all the good stuff. Ain't that right
column2: Winky? <Oralius does his best impersonation of a pirate.> ARRR MATEY! IT BE RIGHT! See what I'm saying? You need to get in there and bring me back some samples of the good stuff. Get in there and shake your moneymaker!

column1: The Eastern Pylon^53^All^Un'Goro Crater^J.D. Collie^J.D. Collie^^Crystals of Power^Making Sense of It^Discover the location of the Eastern Crystal Pylon in Un'Goro Crater.^During my stay here
column2: I have heard strange rumors about mysterious pylons existing out in the wilderness of the crater
column3: <name>. I guess that they are quite large
column4: with crystals lining their interiors. Although I've never seen one
column5: I can't help but think that the rumors are true -- and that the pylons have something to do with all the crystals we found So why don't you help me put my curiosity to rest? Supposedly
column6: there is one in the eastern area of the crater. Do you think you can find it?

column1: The Western Pylon^53^All^Un'Goro Crater^J.D. Collie^J.D. Collie^^Crystals of Power^Making Sense of It^Discover the location of the Western Crystal Pylon.^My experiments so far have not yielded any positive results
column2: <name>. I can't help but hope that you can find a solution by searching for one of the pylons that I have heard exist. Perhaps if we combine certain colors at them... but I get ahead of myself. Let's find them first! <name>
column3: search the western area of the crater; a pylon is said to be somewhere in that area.

column1: The Apes of Un'Goro^55^All^Un'Goro Crater^Torwa Pathfinder^Torwa Pathfinder^^^The Mighty U'cha^Bring 2 Un'Goro Gorilla Pelts
column2: 2 Un'Goro Stomper Pelts
column3: and 2 Un'Goro Thunderer Pelts to Torwa Pathfinder at the entrance of Un'Goro Crater.^This crater has many strange creatures--they seem to be nobler versions of the creatures found throughout my homeland and beyond. I cannot explain it
column4: but this place cries of the Earth Mother. I pay homage to her every time I track one of her beautiful creatures across its basin. If you too wish to feel the enlightenment that accompanies such a great feat
column5: then head to the north. There you'll find great apes who are a test for any mortal's strength. Bring me their pelts... prove your strength.

column1: The Fare of Lar'korwi^53^All^Un'Goro Crater^Torwa Pathfinder^Torwa Pathfinder^The Fare of Lar'korwi^^^Find the carcass of Lar'korwi's freshest kill and steal a Piece of Threshadon Carcass before returning to Torwa Pathfinder in Un'Goro Crater.^Once
column2: a long time ago
column3: a brother of mine took some meat from one of Lar'korwi's kills. He didn't know it at the time
column4: but Lar'korwi saw him from the forest. Lar'korwi followed my brother for days
column5: destroying everything he touched. My brother
column6: scared
column7: finally decided to run from the Crater and leave Lar'korwi behind. Lar'korwi killed him not far from this spot. If you want to provoke Lar'korwi
column8: find a fresh kill of his and take some of the meat from it. Return to me afterwards.

column1: The Scent of Lar'korwi^53^All^Un'Goro Crater^Torwa Pathfinder^Torwa Pathfinder^The Fare of Lar'korwi^^^Bring 2 Ravasaur Pheromone Glands to Torwa Pathfinder near the entrance to Un'Goro Crater.^I'm actually surprised he has not come for you yet
column2: <name>. But all is well
column3: for I have a final plan that will bring the monster to us. Being the dominant male gives Lar'korwi rights to breed with any female he chooses--and he chooses many of them. You'll find many ravasaur eggs to the west of here. Get close to them and you should provoke an attack by his mates. The females produce an awful smell from a gland in their heads that allow males to know they are ready to breed. Bring me two of those glands.

column1: The Bait for Lar'korwi^56^All^Un'Goro Crater^Torwa Pathfinder^Torwa Pathfinder^The Fare of Lar'korwi^^^Using the contents of Torwa's Pouch
column2: summon Lar'korwi and defeat him. Then bring Lar'korwi's Head to Torwa Pathfinder near the entrance to Un'Goro Crater.^This will be the most difficult part because there is some complexity to the plan. To the north of here
column3: you will find a small trail into the mountains. It was here I saw Lar'korwi last. You will know you are in the right area because of all the bones from massive creatures that once wandered nearby. Take the meat you recovered and place it there. Then
column4: rub this mixture I created on the meat. If both lures mingled together do not bring Lar'korwi to you
column5: then I know nothing else that will.

column1: A Sample of Slime...^52^Horde^Undercity^Chemist Fuely^Chemist Fuely^^^Melding of Influences^Gather Felwood Slime Samples from any of the slimes in Felwood. Then
column2: using the Testing Equipment next to Chemist Fuely in Undercity
column3: see which of your samples are the most corrupt. Bring 5 of the Corrupted Felwood Samples you find to Chemist Fuely.^Felwood is a forest far north of the Barrens
column4: even farther than Ashenvale. There
column5: slimes are found all around pools of water blessed by the touch of Fel. The Scourge decimated the area with attacks of Infernals and other demonic magics--the slimes supposedly crept up through the earth during these attacks. Gather samples of Felwood slimes and we will use the testing equipment next to me to create a control group for our tests against other samples you gather.

column1: ... and a Batch of Ooze^56^Horde^Undercity^Chemist Fuely^Chemist Fuely^^^Melding of Influences^Gather Un'Goro Slime Samples from any of the slimes in Un'Goro Crater. Then
column2: using the Testing Equipment next to Chemist Fuely in Undercity
column3: see which of your samples are the most pure. Bring 5 of the Pure Un'Goro Samples you find to Chemist Fuely.^Have you heard of the Un'Goro Crater
column4: <name>? It is near the Tanaris desert
column5: and it is a magnificent place: lush
column6: vibrant
column7: full of creatures and plant life. It is there you must go. Word has reached me that the place seems completely untainted by outside hands. Explorers are just now discovering its secrets. I would like to test the slimes or oozes there. If it is true--that they are uncorrupt--then I would like to see how such creatures have evolved.

column1: Tablet of the Seven^50^All^Burning Steppes^Maxwort Uberglint^Maxwort Uberglint^^^^Collect the Tablet Transcript.^I came to the Burning Steppes
column2: following the legends of the Seven. They were dwarves of great knowledge and power
column3: and if you have knowledge and power
column4: then wealth is sure to follow. That's what I want. Wealth! If we can learn more of the Seven
column5: then maybe we can get rich together. The ruins of Thaurissan is rumored to keep the Tablet of the Seven
column6: which holds knowledge of the ancient dwarves. Find this tablet
column7: copy its text and bring it to me. Let's discover its secrets together!

column1: Food for Baby^47^Alliance^Feralas^Agnar Beastamer^Agnar Beastamer^The Newest Member of the Family^^^Bring 5 Silvermane Stalker Flanks to Agnar Beastamer in Hinterlands.^Sprite darters are omnivores--that means they eat both meat and vegetation. If your egg here's gonna hatch
column2: we best be prepared. Some good eats for these little guys are flanks of meat
column3: raw and juicy
column4: believe it or not. I was never able to find out why
column5: but it has somethin' to do with Elune's plan for the elves... maybe they were to be protectors or somethin'
column6: I don't know. I'll take care of the egg for now
column7: why don't you get me some good Silvermane stalker flanks for 'em to eat when he's hatched.

column1: Becoming a Parent^48^Alliance^Feralas^Agnar Beastamer^Agnar Beastamer^The Newest Member of the Family^^^Speak to Agnar Beastamer in the Hinterlands.^Whoa
column2: it was a lot more ready than I thought...

column1: Bone-Bladed Weapons^52^All^Orgrimmar^Jes'rimon^Jes'rimon^^^^Bring 8 White Ravasaur Claws to Jes'rimon in Orgrimmar.^Hmm
column2: maybe there be somethin' you can do for the Hand now that me think 'bout it. Yes
column3: Jes'rimon could use your help for sure. In Un'Goro Crater there be raptors with deadly claws. Some of those raptors sometimes have white claws instead of ones black like death. The Hand have... clients... that like weapons crafted from these claws. Bring me many of those white claws
column4: and me pay you good coin. Do it fast enough
column5: and maybe me help you in other ways.

column1: The Mighty U'cha^55^All^Un'Goro Crater^Torwa Pathfinder^Torwa Pathfinder^^The Apes of Un'Goro^^Bring U'cha's Pelt to Torwa Pathfinder at the entrance of Un'Goro Crater.^While you have been exploring Un'Goro
column2: I have seen other things that a mighty hunter such as yourself would relish in. One such sight was a huge ape among the other gorillas to the north. You have been to that cave before
column3: but this time
column4: I wonder if you'll survive the encounter if you accept my task. I call him U'cha
column5: and he is one of the Earth Mother's greatest sons
column6: of that you can be sure. Defeat U'cha and bring me his pelt. Do this
column7: and I will defend your right to call yourself a great hunter.

column1: Making Sense of It^53^All^Un'Goro Crater^J.D. Collie^J.D. Collie^^The Northern Pylon
column2: The Eastern Pylon
column3: The Western Pylon^Crystal Restore
column4: Crystal Force
column5: Crystal Ward
column6: Crystal Yield
column7: Crystal Charge
column8: Crystal Spire^Speak with J.D. Collie in a moment.^The information you have given me about the pylons is very interesting... Give me a moment to do some calculations
column9: <name>. Speak to me again in a moment and I should be able to give you the answer we have been looking for.

column1: Yuka Screwspigot^53^All^Blackrock Depths^Yorba Screwspigot^Yuka Screwspigot^Yuka Screwspigot^^^Speak with Yuka Screwspigot in the Burning Steppes.^Although my little brother Ribbly has been worthless his whole life
column2: I think
column3: finally
column4: he has some value! But... we might need your help to capitalize on Ribbly's newfound worth. My sister Yuka has been looking for him for weeks
column5: and tracked him to the Burning Steppes. She sent word to me
column6: asking for some hired hands. So
column7: what do you say? Want to help? If so
column8: then speak with my sister. You'll find her holed up in Flame Crest
column9: a cave northwest of Dreadmaul Rock.

column1: Kharan Mighthammer^59^Alliance^Blackrock Depths^King Magni Bronzebeard^Kharan Mighthammer^^The Smoldering Ruins of Thaurissan^Kharan's Tale^Travel to Blackrock Depths and find Kharan Mighthammer.^You have been to the smoldering ruins of Thaurissan? Did you happen to run into a pitiful lout named Kharan Mighthammer? The dwarf that was supposedly watching over my baby girl! <The King sobs.> And now she's gone
column2: <name>! I have had my men turn the Steppes upside down. The only clue they have as to the whereabouts of my daughter is that she may be inside the Depths. For all I know
column3: she could be dead! Kharan is supposedly being held prisoner there... find him! I want answers!

column1: Kharan's Tale^59^Alliance^Blackrock Depths^Kharan Mighthammer^Kharan Mighthammer^Kharan's Tale^Kharan Mighthammer^^Listen as Kharan Mighthammer tells his story.^Please
column2: hear me out before passing judgement!

column1: The Bearer of Bad News^59^Alliance^Blackrock Depths^Kharan Mighthammer^King Magni Bronzebeard^Kharan's Tale^^^Return to Ironforge and deliver the bad news to King Magni Bronzebeard.^You must take this information back to King Magni
column2: <name>. He will know what to do!

column1: The Fate of the Kingdom^59^Alliance^Blackrock Depths^King Magni Bronzebeard^Princess Moira Bronzebeard^Kharan's Tale^^^Return to Blackrock Depths and rescue Princess Moira Bronzebeard from the evil clutches of Emperor Dagran Thaurissan.^It would seem as if my old adversary
column2: Dagran Thaurissan
column3: has me and the kingdom of Ironforge at his mercy. You may be my last hope
column4: <name>. You must rescue my dear daughter
column5: Moira! There is only one way to make sure that the spell Thaurissan has cast on Moira is broken: Kill him. And <name>
column6: do not harm her! Remember
column7: she is being controlled by Thaurissan! The things she may do or say are a result of Thaurissan's evil spell!

column1: The Princess's Surprise^59^Alliance^Blackrock Depths^Princess Moira Bronzebeard^King Magni Bronzebeard^Kharan's Tale^^^Return to Ironforge and speak with King Magni Bronzebeard.^Thaurissan was a great and honorable dwarf. You ruined my life and the life of my unborn child! <You think that Princess Bronzebeard may still be suffering from the residual effect of the Emperor's spell.> Return to Ironforge and tell my father that the heir to the Kingdom of Ironforge will be a Dark Iron dwarf. Whether he approves or not
column2: it shall be.

column1: Galgar's Cactus Apple Surprise^3^All^Durotar^Galgar^Galgar^^Cutting Teeth^^Bring Galgar 6 Cactus Apples. You remember him saying that they could be found near cactuses.^It sure gets hot out here in the Valley of Trials. <Galgar wipes his brow.> If only I had some cactus apples
column2: I could make my famous cactus apple surprise! Nothing cools you off faster than a piece of that delicious treat. I'll tell you what
column3: <name>. If you bring me 6 cactus apples
column4: I'll make you a few portions of cactus apple surprise to take with you on your adventures. If you're interested
column5: you can find cactus apples growing near the cactus plants around here.

column1: The Corruption of the Jadefire^54^Alliance^Felwood^Eridan Bluewind^Eridan Bluewind^^^Further Corruption^Kill 11 Jadefire Felsworns
column2: 9 Jadefire Shadowstalkers
column3: 9 Jadefire Rogues
column4: and Xavathras. Return to Eridan Bluewind in Felwood when the task has been completed.^Not many seek adventure here... Felwood's corruption is widespread and indiscriminate. As part of the Emerald Circle
column5: I seek to heal this land
column6: but there are some that wish it to fester. The ones I speak of are the Jadefire satyrs that dwell to the northwest of here
column7: at the Ruins of Constellas. Led by a particularly cruel satyr named Xavathras
column8: they continue to spread the disease to any creatures they encounter. We must defend this land that was once ours. Defeat Xavathras and destroy his minions.

column1: Felbound Ancients^54^Alliance^Felwood^Eridan Bluewind^Eridan Bluewind^Flute of Xavaric^^Purified!^Travel to Darnassus and use Eridan's Vial to collect a Vial of Blessed Water from the Temple of the Moon. Return to Eridan with the filled vial.^The flute you found was carved from an ancient protector
column2: the treant allies that have faithfully protected the night elves. The satyrs have been able to corrupt anything they come in contact with
column3: which includes the ancients that made Felwood their home. By the use of the fel
column4: the spirit of the ancient has been bound and tortured
column5: never completely released. The felbind you found is no doubt related. We must try to purify the flute
column6: <name>. Bring me blessed water from the Temple of the Moon in Darnassus.

column1: Purified!^54^Alliance^Felwood^Eridan Bluewind^Eridan Bluewind^^Felbound Ancients^Ancient Spirit^Speak to Eridan again in a moment.^Using the water of Elune
column2: I will attempt to purify the flute. We must end this suffering... May Elune guide my hands and heart. Speak with me again in a moment.

column1: Caught!^45^All^Searing Gorge^Wooden Outhouse^Wooden Outhouse^Caught!^^^Kill 8 Dark Iron Geologists and bring 15 pieces of Silk Cloth to the person locked in the outhouse in Searing Gorge.^Hey! Hey
column2: you! Get over here! Ya gotta help me out. I was runnin' from them Dark Iron dwarves
column3: and I hid in here to get out of sight. Damn geologists and their magic ways! They musta seen me hide
column4: cause next thing I knew
column5: they locked the door and stuck me in here. Teach them geologists a lesson! Oh... an' can ya get me some pieces of silk cloth for... for... nothin'.

column1: Ledger from Tanaris^46^All^Searing Gorge^Wooden Outhouse^Krinkle Goodsteel^Caught!^^^Take the copy of Goodsteel's Ledger and then find the items listed in it before seeking Krinkle Goodsteel in Tanaris.^Oh
column2: you know what? That reminds me. You wanna finish up a little job I took up while I was in Tanaris? It's easy... Krinkle Goodsteel in Gadgetzan was lookin' for some stuff found here in Searing Gorge and a few other places. Maybe you could take a look at the list and then bring it all to him? I'll just slide his ledger under the door if you're interested. Take that
column3: and the stuff he wants back to him after ya collected it all.

column1: The Key to Freedom^47^All^Searing Gorge^Grimesilt Outhouse Key^Wooden Outhouse^^^^Search Searing Gorge and find a use for the Grimesilt Outhouse Key you have found.^The small brass key looks simple enough.. The only thing that seems to make it stand out are some words scratched into the head of it: "Dark Iron Outhouse - Do Not Duplicate." You have no idea what it means or what it will lead to.
The Tome of Nobility^40^Alliance^Paladin^Arthur the Faithful^Duthorian Rall^^^^Speak to Duthorian Rall in Stormwind.^Hello
column2: <name>. I see your dedication remains strong
column3: as does your faith. I think it is time you spoke with Duthorian Rall in Stormwind. There are some more lessons for you to learn
column4: and I feel you are prepared. Seek him out in the Cathedral of Light
column5: and <name>
column6: take these lessons seriously. You've attained your status through humility and hard work
column7: do not disappoint us by becoming arrogant. Be well.

column1: The Tome of Nobility^40^Alliance^Paladin^Brandur Ironhammer^Duthorian Rall^^^^Speak to Duthorian Rall in Stormwind.^Well
column2: well
column3: well
column4: look at the mighty paladin in all <his/her> regality. Sorry
column5: <name>
column6: I meant no offense... I just get a little jealous sometimes when I see some of the feats you've accomplished. Tiza tells me it's my weakness
column7: and I swore to her I'd work on it. It's just hard sometimes
column8: you know? But the reason I wanted to talk to you was because Duthorian Rall in Stormwind sent word for you to meet him in the Cathedral of Light when you're ready. Sounded important. Sounded like something's going on.

column1: A Little Help From My Friends^55^All^Un'Goro Crater^Ringo^Spraggle Frock^^Lost!^^Lead Ringo to Spraggle Frock at Marshal's Refuge.^Ugh... It's so hot... I was exploring this area
column2: when all of a sudden
column3: the heat just became unbearable. I must be suffering from heat exhaustion. Please
column4: help me get back to my friend Spraggle at Marshal's Refuge. I think I'm well enough to follow you there. I am feeling a little out of it
column5: so if I do happen to faint again
column6: just splash some water on me from Spraggle's canteen. That should work
column7: I hope...

column1: Lost!^55^All^Un'Goro Crater^Spraggle Frock^Ringo^^^A Little Help From My Friends^Find Ringo at Fire Plume Ridge.^You've got to help me
column2: <name>! My friend
column3: Ringo left earlier to explore the volcano to the south of here
column4: and he has been gone way too long. I am really worried about him. Do you think you could find him? Why don't you take my canteen with you -- if you do find Ringo
column5: I'm sure he'll need it!

column1: March of the Silithid^53^All^Darnassus^Gracina Spiritmight^Alchemist Pestlezugg^March of the Silithid^^^Speak to Alchemist Pestlezugg in Gadgetzan.^It would seem that the silithid's intent
column2: nay - reason for being
column3: is to devour everything in their path that is not of their ecology. Their focus is singular
column4: and it is for this reason they are a grave threat to all life on Azeroth. What we've seen to date is but the first stages. I suspect that their strength comes from deeper in Kalimdor: Un'Goro Crater. Go to Gadgetzan in the Tanaris desert and speak to Alchemist Pestlezugg. Tell him of my theory; he will surely aid us in fighting the silithid.

column1: March of the Silithid^53^All^Orgrimmar^Zilzibin Drumlore^Alchemist Pestlezugg^March of the Silithid^^^Speak to Alchemist Pestlezugg in Gadgetzan.^It would seem that the silithid's intent
column2: nay - reason for being
column3: is to devour everything in their path that is not of their ecology. Their focus is singular
column4: and it is for this reason they are a grave threat to all life on Azeroth. What we've seen to date is but the first stages. I suspect that their strength comes from deeper in Kalimdor: Un'Goro Crater. Go to Gadgetzan in the Tanaris desert and speak to Alchemist Pestlezugg. Tell him of my theory; he will surely aid us in fighting the silithid.

column1: A Good Friend^4^All^Teldrassil^Dirania Silvershine^Iverron^^^A Friend in Need^Find Iverron by the cave to the north.^A friend of mine named Iverron usually visits me at the same time every day. The strange thing is that he hasn't been by today at all -- he's several hours late
column2: in fact. I admit
column3: I am a little worried
column4: <name>. Iverron spends a lot of time over by the cave to the north
column5: and I'm sure you know how dangerous it is there -- spiders
column6: everywhere! If you happen to be going that way
column7: though
column8: will you keep an eye out for him?

column1: Bungle in the Jungle^53^All^Tanaris^Alchemist Pestlezugg^Alchemist Pestlezugg^March of the Silithid^^Pawn Captures Queen^Bring a Gorishi Scent Gland and 5 Un'Goro Soil samples to Alchemist Pestlezugg in Gadgetzan.^My research revealed to me that the silithid are like bees; destroy the queen of the hive
column2: and the rest of should be thrown into disarray. I'll brew a lure that we'll use to bring out the queen; once summoned
column3: you'll take her down. First though
column4: we need some reagents; we don't want you bungling into the jungle unprepared. Go west to find the silithid hive in Un'Goro Crater and obtain a scent gland from one of the bugs. I'll also need some samples of the native Un'Goro soil.

column1: Beware of Pterrordax^55^All^Un'Goro Crater^Beware of Pterrordax^Spraggle Frock^^^^Kill 10 Frenzied Pterrordax
column2: then speak to Spraggle Frock at Marshal's Refuge.^Wanted: A skilled fighter to deal with the threat of the Pterrordax that inhabit the Un'Goro Crater. Their numbers are growing
column3: and they are becoming a menace to travelers in the area. Decrease the population by slaying 10 frenzied pterrordax. Speak with Spraggle Frock after completing the task for a reward.

column1: Volcanic Activity^55^All^Un'Goro Crater^Liv Rizzlefix^Liv Rizzlefix^^^^Collect 9 samples of Un'Goro Ash from the fire elementals around the volcano in Un'Goro Crater
column2: and return them to Liv Rizzlefix in Ratchet.^Being an apprentice to Marvon Rivetseeker
column3: I've learned so much. But he's been gone for such a long time now
column4: so I think I'm going to work on some experiments of my own. I've been reading about Un'Goro Crater most recently
column5: and about the strange volcanic activity going on in the middle of the crater. I think a lot could be learned if I could just get some of the ash from the elementals there. Do you think you'd mind collecting some for me
column6: if you are going that way?

column1: Shizzle's Flyer^51^All^Un'Goro Crater^Shizzle^Shizzle^^^^Collect 8 Webbed Diemetradon Scales and 8 Webbed Pterrordax Scales for Shizzle in Marshal's Refuge.^I'm making a flying machine! I got stranded here
column2: and I'm absolutely horrible at finding my way around. I'd take a gryphon or wind rider back to Gadgetzan
column3: but those beasts just scare me to death. So
column4: will you help me? All I have left to build is the wings
column5: and I was thinking that the webby scales from the pterrordax and diemetradon would be perfect. There's no way I'm going to go up against one of those
column6: but you look pretty tough. Why don't you give it a try?

column1: Super Sticky^54^All^Tanaris^Tran'rek^Tran'rek^^^^Collect 12 samples of Super Sticky Tar for Tran'rek in Gadgetzan.^I'm always looking for a quick way to earn a gold
column2: <name>. If you help me with my newest idea
column3: I'll let you in on a little of the profit. How does that sound to you? I thought so! Head to the tar pits in northern Un'Goro Crater
column4: and collect me some tar. Not just any tar
column5: now
column6: you'll need to get it from the beasts that live around the tar pits. Regular tar just simply isn't sticky enough. The plant-like creatures contain chlorophyll in their skin
column7: and mixed with the tar
column8: it's super sticky!

column1: Well of Corruption^54^Horde^Felwood^Winna Hazzard^Winna Hazzard^A Strange One^^Corrupted Sabers^Collect a sample of corrupted water from the Jadefire Satyrs' moonwell and bring it to Winna Hazzard at Bloodvenom Post.^Some may say that I am exceptionally cruel... But truly
column2: it is only a strong desire to see the Horde gain an advantage against the Alliance
column3: in any way possible. My newest interest is a moonwell at the Ruins of Constellas
column4: south of here
column5: tended by the Jadefire satyrs. The moonwell
column6: once a symbol of renewal for the insufferable night elves
column7: is now corrupted
column8: and used to bring forth more satyrs. I have an idea
column9: <name>
column10: and I'd like a sample of the water... for my little feline friend here.

column1: Corrupted Sabers^54^Horde^Felwood^Winna Hazzard^Winna Hazzard^^Well of Corruption^^Take Winna's kitten to the corrupted moonwell
column2: release it
column3: then bring it back to Winna.^This corrupted water can be used to our advantage
column4: <name>. With just a small amount of the water
column5: my kitten doubled in size
column6: and seems to be stronger... somehow. These cats may prove useful... Here
column7: <name>. Take this cat carrier
column8: and release the kitten inside next to the moonwell in the Ruins of Constellas. Heh
column9: heh... I'm sure you'll be pleased with the results! Return the cat to me
column10: and I'm sure I can make it worth your time.

column1: Pawn Captures Queen^54^All^Tanaris^Alchemist Pestlezugg^Alchemist Pestlezugg^^Bungle in the Jungle^Calm Before the Storm
column2: Calm Before the Storm^Defeat the Gorishi Hive Queen once she is summoned.^Here's the lure. Inside the hive network should be a crystal of some sort. We think the silithid use the crystal as some sort of hive-wide attunement device. As for where this crystal might be
column3: I'd say try the hatcheries inside the hive. Using the lure on the crystal should roust out the queen
column4: but be warned - she will probably be protected by several guards. Take out the queen and remove her brain. As icky as that sounds
column5: we desperately need to study it. Good luck
column6: <name>!

column1: Calm Before the Storm^54^Alliance^Tanaris^Alchemist Pestlezugg^Gracina Spiritmight^Calm Before the Storm^Pawn Captures Queen^^Bring Pestlezugg's Un'Goro Report to Gracina Spiritmight in Darnassus.^My recent findings and the knowledge we have gained here today needs to reach hands that can quite possibly do something with it. As resourceful as we are here in Gadgetzan
column2: we can't do this alone. Take my latest report back to Gracina Spiritmight in Darnassus; she's still at the Temple of the Moon
column3: is she not? She's got friends who are Alliance bigwigs; if we can get them involved in this <name>
column4: then we just might make it out of this alive.

column1: Calm Before the Storm^54^Horde^Tanaris^Alchemist Pestlezugg^Zilzibin Drumlore^Calm Before the Storm^Pawn Captures Queen^^Bring Pestlezugg's Un'Goro Report to Zilzibin Drumlore in Orgrimmar.^My recent findings and the knowledge we have gained here today needs to reach hands that can quite possibly do something with it. As resourceful as we are here in Gadgetzan
column2: we can't do this alone. Take my latest report back to Zilzibin Drumlore in Orgrimmar; he's still in his place on the upper part of the Drag
column3: is he not? He's got friends who are high within the Horde; if we can get them involved in this <name>
column4: then we just might make it out of this alive.

column1: Calm Before the Storm^54^Alliance^Darnassus^Gracina Spiritmight^Idriana^Calm Before the Storm^^^Bring the Bank Voucher to Idriana in the bank of Darnassus.^<name>
column2: your help has been immeasurable. The time will come
column3: no doubt
column4: when I'll ask for your assistance against the silithid once more. We must absorb what we have learned in Un'Goro; I fear that my assumptions that the silithid originated from Un'Goro are now wrong... that indeed there is a far stronger presence somewhere. Take this note to Idriana at the bank. She'll give you something from my vault that should be viewed as a token of my gratitude. Thank you for your assistance
column5: brave <class>.

column1: Calm Before the Storm^54^Horde^Orgrimmar^Zilzibin Drumlore^Karus^Calm Before the Storm^^^Bring the Bank Voucher to Karus in the bank of Orgrimmar.^<name>
column2: we could not have gotten this far without you. The time will come soon
column3: no doubt
column4: when I'll ask for your help against the silithid once more. We must absorb what we have learned in Un'Goro; I fear that my assumptions that the silithid originated from Un'Goro are now wrong... that indeed there is a far stronger presence somewhere. Take this note to Karus at the bank. He'll give you something from my vault that should be viewed as a token of my gratitude. Thank you for your assistance
column5: mighty <class>.

column1: A Little Slime Goes a Long Way^52^Alliance^Ironforge^Laris Geardawdle^Laris Geardawdle^^^A Little Slime Goes a Long Way^Bring 6 Filled Cursed Ooze Jars and 6 Filled Tainted Ooze Jars to Laris Geardawdle in Ironforge.^But the thing I've studied most is ooze. I know it sounds odd
column2: but they're all over! I helped a lady in Menethil find her bag not too long ago--it was eaten by oozes. I've seen members of the Royal Apothecary Society from Undercity collecting samples of the stuff. I want to know why! Where does it come from? I've heard of more in Felwood. What I need are samples of the oozes there so I can further my research. I'll give you containers
column3: you use them to collect a sample from the deceased creatures.

column1: A Little Slime Goes a Long Way^54^Alliance^Ironforge^Laris Geardawdle^Laris Geardawdle^^A Little Slime Goes a Long Way^^Bring 10 Filled Pure Sample Jars to Laris Geardawdle in Ironforge.^I'm going to need more samples
column2: <name>. But--and I don't know how to put this--they have to be pure samples. I know
column3: I know. "What does 'pure' mean
column4: Laris?" I'm not sure. I do know that these are corrupt... just like Felwood. Which is what makes my realization so important. The oozes seem to adapt... to take on the aspects of the area they're in. I'll need to find samples that haven't been polluted. But where? Where?! Bah! <name>
column5: take these containers just in case you find any on your own.

column1: Wild Guardians^56^Horde^Felwood^Trull Failbane^Trull Failbane^Wild Guardians^^^Trull Failbane in Felwood wants you to kill 15 Raging Owlbeasts and 15 Ragged Owlbeasts.^Winterspring lies just beyond Timbermaw
column2: northeast of Felwood. Have you been there? I have heard that the area is laden with creatures called wildkin. These beasts have been known to guard secrets; secrets of the Night elves. We must figure out what may be hidden in Winterspring. I have heard the ragged owlbeasts can be found just south of the road
column3: and that there are others called raging owlbeasts that may be found in the center of Winterspring. Clear them out
column4: and gain access to the land.

column1: Kayneth Stillwind^29^Alliance^Ashenvale^Shindrell Swiftfire^Kayneth Stillwind^^^Forsaken Diseases^Take Shindrell's Note to Kayneth Stillwind in Forest Song.^The druid Kayneth Stillwind sent word to me. He would like a report of the happenings along our coast and in the forests surrounding Astranaar. He fears there is a corruption moving through Ashenvale... and he may be right. Here
column2: take my report to him. You will find him in the shrine of Forest Song
column3: in the Nightsong Woods to the east.

column1: The Sparklematic 5200!^30^All^Dun Morogh^The Sparklematic 5200^The Sparklematic 5200^^^The Sparklematic 5200!^Insert a Grime-Encrusted Item into the Sparklematic 5200
column2: and be sure to have three silver coins to start the machine.^This contraption stands out amongst the gnomes holding out against the madness outside the room. A small plaque on the device reads "The Sparklematic 5200"
column3: followed by some text: "Grime and residue ruining your sparklies? The Sparklematic 5200 puts the shine back in shine-tastic! Insert the item you wish to clean and deposit three silver coins in the coin slot. Give the Sparklematic 5200 a moment for operation
column4: and voila! Your valuables will emerge clean and shiny!"

column1: The Sparklematic 5200!^30^All^Dun Morogh^The Sparklematic 5200^The Sparklematic 5200^^^The Sparklematic 5200!^Insert a Grime-Encrusted Item into the Sparklematic 5200
column2: and be sure to have three silver coins to start the machine.^This contraption stands out amongst the gnomes holding out against the madness outside the room. A small plaque on the device reads "The Sparklematic 5200"
column3: followed by some text: "Grime and residue ruining your sparklies? The Sparklematic 5200 puts the shine back in shine-tastic! Insert the item you wish to clean and deposit three silver coins in the coin slot. Give the Sparklematic 5200 a moment for operation
column4: and voila! Your valuables will emerge clean and shiny!"

column1: Avast Ye
column2: Admiral!^60^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Fleet Master Firallon^Fleet Master Firallon^Avast Ye
column3: Scallywag^^^Slay Fleet Master Seahorn and Baron Revilgaz of Booty Bay
column4: and then return to Fleet Master Firallon aboard the Crimson Veil off the coast of Stranglethorn Vale.^Listen close
column5: sea dawg... the powers of Booty Bay is what keeps us Bloodsail from sailing wheres we like and taking whats we want as rights o' plunder. Were ye to put a knife to Fleet Master Seahorn
column6: we'd ne'er run afoul of a Booty Bay's vessel. Were ye to put a knife to Baron Revilgaz
column7: we'd ne'er face the law on their terms. If ye are to be an honorary admiral amongst us - yes
column8: ADMIRAL
column9: you'll puts a knife to both of 'em as I've says. Go now <lad /lass>
column10: and return to me once ye does the deeds.

column1: Your Place In The World^1^Horde^Durotar^Kaltunk^Gornek^Your Place In The World^^^Speak with Gornek. You recall Kaltunk marking your map with his location and mentioning that Gornek resided in the Den
column2: a building to the west.^Finally
column3: you are of age
column4: <name>... of age to battle in the name of the Horde. To conquer for the glory of the Warchief. Yes... <Kaltunk looks you over.> You will do nicely. No doubt you wish to find a great dragon or demon and strangle it with your bare hands
column5: but perhaps it would be wise to start on something less... dangerous. <Kaltunk laughs.> Report to Gornek
column6: he should be able to assign a task better suited to a young <class>. You will find Gornek in the Den
column7: to the west.

column1: Melding of Influences^55^Horde^Undercity^Chemist Fuely^Chemist Fuely^^A Sample of Slime...
column2: ... and a Batch of Ooze^^Bring a Merged Ooze Sample to Chemist Fuely in Undercity.^Here is some encased ooze created from the Felwood samples you recovered. Take the case to Un'Goro Crater and find a pure ooze... the primal variety will do nicely. When you get close enough
column3: release the ooze in the case
column4: and let us see what the two think of one another. After the experiment concludes
column5: bring me a sample of whatever is left over. I will await you here in the Apothecarium.

column1: Washed Ashore^14^All^Darkshore^Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde^Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde^Washed Ashore^^Beached Sea Turtle
column2: Beached Sea Creature
column3: Beached Sea Turtle
column4: Beached Sea Turtle
column5: Beached Sea Creature
