column6: Beached Sea Creature
column7: Beached Sea Turtle
column8: Beached Sea Turtle
column9: Beached Sea Creature^Recover the Sea Turtle Remains from the Skeletal Sea Turtle in the waters west of Auberdine
column10: and then speak with Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde back in Auberdine.^That beached creature is not an isolated incident here in Darkshore. There are more along the coastline and even in the water. I would like for you to investigate another one that we know of; this one was reported to be in the water due west of Auberdine
column11: close to a sunken vessel. Return to me with anything that you may recover that would aid our research. Also
column12: in your travels you may find other creatures. By all means
column13: if you should discover anything then please bring it to our attention!

column1: Put Her Down^59^All^Blackrock Spire^Helendis Riverhorn^Helendis Riverhorn^^^^Travel to Blackrock Spire and destroy the source of the worg menace. As you left Helendis
column2: he shouted a name: Halycon. It is what the orcs refer to in regards to the worg.^You have no doubt seen the worgs which the Blackrock orcs command. It is curious - no matter how many we destroy
column3: their numbers never dwindle. My scouts have reported that the worgs are bred
column4: trained
column5: and ultimately exported from Blackrock Spire: capital city of the Blackrock orcs. You must travel to Blackrock Spire and discover the source of this menace. Discover... and destroy. Good luck
column6: <name>. May Cenarius protect you...

column1: Wild Guardians^59^Horde^Felwood^Trull Failbane^Trull Failbane^Wild Guardians^^^Trull Failbane in Felwood wants you to hunt 10 Berserk Owlbeasts in Winterspring.^Runners have returned from Winterspring with reports that there is a series of small caves in the southern area of Winterspring. It seems that there are wildkin situated in the area around these caves. If there is something valuable that they are guarding
column2: I believe that this is the place we will find it. You will find these to be more of a challenge than the previous types
column3: <name>. The creatures seem to have gone mad from exposure to the very thing that they strive to protect.

column1: Beached Sea Turtle^13^Alliance^Darkshore^Beached Sea Turtle^Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde^^Washed Ashore^^Take the Sea Turtle Remains to Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine.^You find a corpse of a sea turtle that had beached itself on the coast of Darkshore some time ago. It has been scavenged by the murlocs who have encamped themselves around the creature's remains. Still
column2: there appear to be some suitable samples left on the creature's remains that Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine might be able to make use of.

column1: Beached Sea Creature^13^Alliance^Darkshore^Beached Sea Creature^Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde^^Washed Ashore^^Take the Sea Creature Bones to Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine.^The remains of a giant thresher - much larger than one you'd expect to find in Darkshore - lie beached on the coast of the Mist's Edge. How this creature came to be here is unknown; the group of murlocs that now feast off the carcass of it seem to be much too weak
column2: even in large numbers
column3: to have brought down the beast. While some of it has been picked clean
column4: enough of it remains to take a sample for Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine to study.

column1: The Pack Mistress^59^Horde^Blackrock Spire^Galamav the Marksman^Galamav the Marksman^^^^Slay Halycon
column2: pack mistress of the Bloodaxe worg.^Some say the worg controlled by the Blackrock orcs are the creation of a supernatural force. Others say they are not true worg but instead a breed of demon dog
column3: granted to the orcs by a fallen pit lord. The truth is far less contrived but every bit as frightening. The worg of Blackrock come from Halycon and her mate. Halycon is the gigantic den mother of the worg. Her mate? Nobody has ever lived to tell the tale of that one. Strike at the heart of the worg. Destroy Halycon... and <name>
column4: watch your back.

column1: Beached Sea Turtle^15^Alliance^Darkshore^Beached Sea Turtle^Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde^^Washed Ashore^^Take the Strangely Marked Box to Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine.^More sea turtle remains lie beached along the coastline. This particular set has an abandoned carriage attached to the turtle's shell. Perhaps this creature was driven to the shoreline by unknown beings rather than beaching itself as some of the other remains suggested. Greymist murlocs now make the remains of this creature their home
column2: feasting off the carrion. In the carriage
column3: you find a box with strange markings on it; perhaps Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine can make sense of it.

column1: Broodling Essence^52^All^Burning Steppes^Tinkee Steamboil^Tinkee Steamboil^Broodling Essence^^^Bring 8 Broodling Essence and the Draco-Incarcinatrix 900 to Tinkee Steamboil at the Flame Crest in the Burning Steppes.^I have been studying the dragonkin of the Burning Steppes for weeks
column2: and I think I've finally had a breakthrough! I created a device--I call it the Draco Incarcinatrix 900. It can capture the essence of dragon whelp broodlings! Or
column3: at least I think it can. Here
column4: take the device and zap a broodling in the Burning Steppes with it. While it's under the device's effects
column5: defeat the broodling and its essence should be released. If it is
column6: then splendid! Bring me back samples so I can study them!

column1: Beached Sea Turtle^15^Alliance^Darkshore^Beached Sea Turtle^Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde^^Washed Ashore^^Take the Sea Turtle Remains to Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine.^The skeletal remains of a sea turtle lie in the sand of the northern Darkshore beaches. The Greymist murlocs have either not found this carcass
column2: or perhaps they have and are shying away from it for some unknown reason. Regardless
column3: there is enough of the turtle left to take a sample back to Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine for the Temple of the Moon to study.

column1: Beached Sea Creature^14^Alliance^Darkshore^Beached Sea Creature^Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde^^Washed Ashore^^Take the Sea Creature Bones to Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine.^The corpse of what appears to be some sort of giant sea mammal lies partially gutted on the beach. A wheelbarrow and various tools lie abandoned by this enormous beached sea creature
column2: as though an attempt to study it had been made previously. Though murlocs have scavenged this beast
column3: enough of it remains to gather a suitable sample for Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine.

column1: Kibler's Exotic Pets^59^All^Blackrock Spire^Kibler^Kibler^^^^Travel to Blackrock Spire and find Bloodaxe Worg Pups. Use the cage to carry the ferocious little beasts. Bring back a Caged Worg Pup to Kibler.^You're probably wondering what I'm doing out here. Look at the cages! Ain't it obvious? I'm an animal lover
column2: first and foremost
column3: but a salesman by trade. I track down exotic animals for the rich and famous and domesticate the beasts so they behave as proper pets. Now you're probably wondering
column4: "What can I do for you
column5: Kibler." The answer is simple: Take this here beast cage and find me some worg pups. For that
column6: I'll domesticate a worg for you!

column1: Beached Sea Creature^16^Alliance^Darkshore^Beached Sea Creature^Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde^^Washed Ashore^^Take the Sea Creature Bones to Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine.^The half-devoured corpse of what might have been a giant sea mammal lies on the beach. A band of murlocs
column2: stronger than those found closer to Auberdine
column3: have taken up residence around the fallen creature. Enough of the creature remains that a suitable sample of its bones could be delivered to Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine.

column1: Beached Sea Turtle^19^Alliance^Darkshore^Beached Sea Turtle^Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde^^Washed Ashore^^Take the Strangely Marked Box to Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine.^Another set of sea turtle remains lie beached on the coastline. This set of remains has an abandoned carriage half buckled to the turtle's shell. Perhaps this creature was driven to the shoreline by unknown beings rather than beaching itself as some of the other remains suggested. Powerful Greymist murlocs have made the carcass of this creature their current home. In the carriage
column2: you find a box with strange markings on it; perhaps Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine can make sense of it.

column1: Beached Sea Turtle^19^Alliance^Darkshore^Beached Sea Turtle^Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde^^Washed Ashore^^Take the Sea Turtle Remains to Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine.^You find a corpse of a sea turtle that had beached itself on the coast of Darkshore some time ago. It has been picked nearly clean by Greymist murlocs
column2: the very ones who now have encamped themselves around the creature's remains. Still
column3: there appear to be some suitable samples left on the creature's remains that Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine might be able to make use of.

column1: Beached Sea Creature^19^Alliance^Darkshore^Beached Sea Creature^Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde^^Washed Ashore^^Take the Sea Creature Bones to Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine.^The remains of what appear to be a giant thresher have washed ashore on the rocky inlet of the Twilight Shore. The thresher is several times larger than any of the other threshers spotted in these parts. Wherever it came from
column2: this creature would not seem to have been native to Darkshore. Though the creature has been picked apart in places
column3: enough of it remains to gather a suitable sample for Gwennyth Bly'Leggonde in Auberdine.

column1: Egg Freezing^60^All^Blackrock Spire^Tinkee Steamboil^Tinkee Steamboil^Tinkee Steamboil^^Egg Collection
column2: Leonid Barthalomew^Use the Eggscilloscope Prototype on an egg in the Rookery of Blackrock Spire.^<name>
column3: I've been working hard on a new device
column4: the eggscilloscope! It's designed to project a burst of cold energy at the egg of a black dragon... and freeze it solid! Can you test it for me? I heard that high up in Blackrock Spire
column5: the dragons have a rookery where they hatch their eggs. That's where you'll have to go to test the eggscilloscope
column6: and then let me know how it worked! And don't worry. Frozen dragon eggs should be harmless. It's the unfrozen ones you have to worry about!

column1: Egg Collection^60^All^Blackrock Spire^Tinkee Steamboil^Tinkee Steamboil^^Egg Freezing^Leonid Barthalomew^Bring 8 Collected Dragon Eggs and the Collectronic Module to Tinkee Steamboil at Flame Crest in the Burning Steppes.^<name>
column2: I'm finally ready for real samples of dragon eggs! Here
column3: take this collectronic module. It's designed to extract a dragon egg and prepare it for transport. Go back to the Rookery and use the module to collect eggs. And don't forget to freeze them first
column4: or they might hatch before you can collect them! When you have enough eggs
column5: bring them to me!

column1: In Search of Menara Voidrender^31^Alliance^Warlock^Briarthorn^Menara Voidrender^In Search of Menara Voidrender^^^Speak to Menara Voidrender in the Barrens.^Ah
column2: hello
column3: <name>. You're progressing well in your training. So well in fact that I think you should be rewarded for your hard work--and for not becoming corrupted by the arcane yet. If you're interested
column4: seek out Menara Voidrender in Ratchet. She is currently staying at Strahad Farsan's tower overlooking the town. She's not very friendly
column5: <name>
column6: so don't expect any praise. But if you work hard
column7: she'll make sure you're taken care of.

column1: In Search of Menara Voidrender^31^Horde^Warlock^Zevrost^Menara Voidrender^In Search of Menara Voidrender^^^Speak to Menara Voidrender in the Barrens.^Hmph
column2: still you strive to become more powerful. I say it's only time before the corruption and addiction takes hold of you and you become a slave to that which you seek to gain power over. Pfah! A fool you are! Time will prove me right--nothing else... just time. But it seems that not all agree with Zevrost. It seems Menara would create tools for you to become more powerful and to harness your strength. If you're interested
column3: then go to Ratchet in the Barrens. She is there overlooking the town.

column1: In Search of Menara Voidrender^31^Alliance^Warlock^Demisette Cloyce^Menara Voidrender^In Search of Menara Voidrender^^^Speak with Menara Voidrender in the Barrens.^Let us be clear about one thing
column2: <name>: I don't feel you are ready for such responsibilities. I don't think aiding in the creation of any item of power is something a novice should ever be involved in; especially one so untested. But that's not my decision. The powers that be
column3: or at least the ones that do wish to impart such gifts upon you get to decide that. If you're interested in learning more
column4: I suggest you seek out Menara Voidrender in Ratchet. She usually resides in the tower above the port town.

column1: In Search of Menara Voidrender^31^Horde^Warlock^Kaal Soulreaper^Menara Voidrender^In Search of Menara Voidrender^^^Speak to Menara Voidrender in the Barrens.^<class>! Yes
column2: you! You don't have all the accoutrements
column3: but it's plain to see you're ready--the air around you exudes greater confidence. Yes
column4: I see it now. Menara Voidrender would teach you a few things if you feel you're ready. She spends her time tutoring younger students in the arcane. She even gives gifts to those who pass her tests. Go to Ratchet in the Barrens if you're interested. She's above the city in Strahad's tower.

column1: WANTED: Murkdeep!^18^All^Darkshore^WANTED: Murkdeep!^Sentinel Glynda Nal'Shea^^^^Find and slay the murloc known as Murkdeep. The creature is thought to be defending the murloc huts south of Auberdine along the water.^Attention! A reward is being offered for the death of the murloc "Murkdeep". This foul beast is known to be responsible for the death of at least one Sentinel
column2: and is suspected of causing the sinking of at least two cargo vessels in the waters off Darkshore! Murkdeep was last spotted at a hutted murloc camp south of Auberdine
column3: and is thought to be protecting the huts there. Reward claims for this bounty should be claimed with Sentinel Glynda Nal'Shea in Auberdine. The Auberdine Village Council

column1: Wild Guardians^58^Horde^Felwood^Trull Failbane^Trull Failbane^Wild Guardians^^^Trull Failbane in Felwood wants you to hunt 13 Moontouched Owlbeasts.^In the northern areas of Winterspring
column2: the Wildkin grow even more ferocious. We must continue our measures there. Hunt the moontouched owlbeasts in Winterspring
column3: and explore the area they inhabit. This is dangerous ground
column4: but I know that you will be able to handle the challenge. Return to me after you have slain 13 of the wildkin.

column1: Seal of Ascension^60^All^Blackrock Spire^Vaelan^Vaelan^Seal of Ascension^^^Find the three gemstones of command: The Gemstone of Smolderthorn
column2: Gemstone of Spirestone
column3: and Gemstone of Bloodaxe. Return them
column4: along with the Unadorned Seal of Ascension
column5: to Vaelan.^As you can see
column6: the unadorned seal has three empty sockets. Each of those sockets must be filled with a gemstone representing the leadership's command. Finally
column7: Overlord Wyrmthalak
column8: master of the lower citadel
column9: must forge the seal in the flames of the Black Dragonflight. Understand this
column10: mortal: the chance that one of the three generals of the lower citadel would carry a gemstone at any given time is rare. You must be vigilant in your quest. Remain determined!

column1: Seal of Ascension^60^All^Blackrock Spire^Vaelan^Vaelan^Seal of Ascension^^^Travel to the Wyrmbog in Dustwallow Marsh. Find the ancient drake
column2: Emberstrife and beat him without mercy until his will is broken.^Few of the black dragonkin
column3: outside of those in the upper citadel
column4: have the ability to forge the seal with their own flaming breath. Wyrmthalak is one such dragonkin
column5: but his will is unbreakable. You must travel to the Wyrmbog in Dustwallow Marsh. It is there that you will find an ancient drake known as Emberstrife. You must break his will
column6: <name>. Break it and use this orb on his weakened form. You will have scant seconds to control his mind and fan the flames that will forge the seal.

column1: Thundris Windweaver^15^All^Darkshore^Terenthis^Thundris Windweaver^Thundris Windweaver^How Big a Threat?^^Speak with Thundris Windweaver in Auberdine.^Your scouting of the furbolg camp is information that Thundris Windweaver should be made aware of. He graciously serves as the elder of Auberdine
column2: offering sage and just stewardship of the day to day affairs of the village. Please - share with him your findings to date on the furbolg situation. I believe he has some ideas of his own on the reasons behind their corruption. Perhaps you can work with him to enact a plan to restore the balance of nature here!

column1: The Cliffspring River^15^All^Darkshore^Thundris Windweaver^Thundris Windweaver^Thundris Windweaver^^The Blackwood Corrupted^Travel north of Auberdine to the first waterfall along the Cliffspring River and draw a sample from the pool there.^The Cliffspring River has begun turning foul and corrupted. It empties into the Mist's Edge
column2: and I fear the wash will affect Auberdine soon. I suspect the Blackwood furbolgs up-river are the cause of the taint
column3: but I also suspect that they aren't the true root of it. Take this sampling tube and go to the mouth of the river to our north. Proceed inland to the first waterfall and draw a sample from the pool there. You'll see a bridge overhead. Once you have a sample
column4: return to me in Auberdine.

column1: The Blackwood Corrupted^18^All^Darkshore^Thundris Windweaver^Thundris Windweaver^^The Cliffspring River^^Fill the Empty Cleansing Bowl at the Auberdine Moonwell.^We've learned that a source of furbolg corruption is from the satyr. They hold sway via talismans that they channel magic through. If the furbolg have a chance at salvation
column2: we must lure out the satyr corruptor and take that talisman! Fill this bowl at our moonwell and take samples of the furbolgs' food from their northern camp. Mix them and place it near the bonfire by the river; any furbolgs who eat will be cleansed just long enough to lure out the satyr corruptor... who then you must slay!

column1: Doomrigger's Clasp^60^Alliance^Blackrock Spire^Mayara Brightwing^Mayara Brightwing^Mayara Brightwing^^^Bring Doomrigger's Clasp to Mayara Brightwing in the Burning Steppes.^There is a chamber
column2: high in Blackrock Spire
column3: that was once called the Hall of Fortune. It was where the Dark Iron dwarves kept their relics
column4: trophies and objects of art. That was long ago. It is said the hall has collapsed and is now used for... less savory tasks. But I believe some old dwarven relics may still be found there. One such relic is Doomrigger's clasp
column5: with a surface so encrusted with rare gems that it was said to make weep any dwarf who gazes upon it. That clasp
column6: <name>
column7: is your goal.

column1: Delivery to Ridgewell^60^Alliance^Blackrock Spire^Mayara Brightwing^Count Remington Ridgewell^Mayara Brightwing^^^Bring Ridgewell's Crate to Count Remington Ridgewell at Stormwind Keep in Stormwind.^I have packaged Doomriggers Clasp into a crate
column2: suitable for shipment to Stormwind. <name>
column3: you have been extremely helpful -- can I ask you for one last favor? Deliver the crate to Count Remington Ridgewell. You will find him in the Keep of Stormwind. I am sure he'll be very pleased to see what you have for him.

column1: Mayara Brightwing^60^Alliance^Blackrock Spire^Count Remington Ridgewell^Mayara Brightwing^Mayara Brightwing^^^Speak with Mayara Brightwing at Morgan's Vigil in the Burning Steppes.^An agent of mine
column2: Mayara Brightwing
column3: was sent to the Burning Steppes to scout the ruined city of Thaurissan. That destroyed city of the Dark Iron dwarves may hide objects of great value... objects that would fit nicely into our family museum. Mayara says she found something and will need aid in retrieving it
column4: but it is not in Thaurissan. Instead
column5: a foray into Blackrock Spire will be required. I do not know the details
column6: but if interested then speak with Mayara in the Burning Steppes.

column1: Wind Rider^29^Horde^Thousand Needles^Elu^Elu^^^^Bring 10 Highperch Wyvern Eggs to Elu in Freewind Post.^I've been tasked to recruit more wyverns for the master wind riders. Their numbers are growing and I myself hope to become a wind rider one day. However
column2: we cannot train enough wyverns to keep up with the demand. Perhaps you can help me
column3: <name>. I need you to travel to Highperch to gather some wyvern eggs. From here
column4: head northwest along the canyon walls to a ramp that will lead you into Highperch. Be careful
column5: wyverns are very protective over their eggs and they will not be kind to intruders.

column1: The Darkstone Tablet^60^All^Blackrock Spire^Shadowmage Vivian Lagrave^Shadowmage Vivian Lagrave^Vivian Lagrave and the Darkstone Tablet^^^Bring the Darkstone Tablet to Shadow Mage Vivian Lagrave in Kargath.^The Darkstone Tablet holds the writings of the long-dead dwarf Urheld Darkstone. An alchemist of great skill
column2: he was thought insane by his contemporaries and
column3: hence
column4: did not share his research. But he did etch it onto tablets
column5: and I believe one such tablet lies in Blackrock Spire
column6: in a chamber once named the Hall of Fortune. I know not what it is now called
column7: for few enter Blackrock and return. But if you are willing to brave its dangers and return to me with the tablet
column8: your reward will be great.

column1: Vivian Lagrave and the Darkstone Tablet^60^All^Blackrock Spire^Apothecary Zinge^Shadowmage Vivian Lagrave^Vivian Lagrave and the Darkstone Tablet^^^Speak with Shadowmage Vivian Lagrave.^Vivian Lagrave sent me word from Kargath
column2: in the Badlands. Through her studies
column3: she believes there is an ancient text within Blackrock Spire that would benefit our research. To confirm this
column4: she will need someone to extract the text from the spire. No easy task. If interested
column5: then speak with Vivian in Kargath.

column1: Homeward Bound^29^Horde^Thousand Needles^Pao'ka Swiftmountain^Motega Firemane^^^^Escort Pao'ka Swiftmountain from Highperch
column2: and then talk to Motega Firemane in Whitereach Post.^Please help me
column3: <class>! I've been hiding here in Highperch for some time now and it's been days since I've seen a friendly face. I came here to study the wyvern and I think I got a little too close. After being chased away from one of the nests I got lost. I need to get back to Whitereach Post! Motega does not know that I am missing and will be furious to know that I ventured into Highperch by myself. Whitereach Post is just east of here... please take me there!

column1: Dawn's Gambit^60^All^Scholomance^Betina Bigglezink^Betina Bigglezink^Leonid Barthalomew^^^Place Dawn's Gambit in the Viewing Room of the Scholomance. Defeat Vectus
column2: then return to Betina Bigglezink.^I've placed Dawn's Gambit in the container you brought to us
column3: the one that held the dragon eggs. Your job is to bring it deep within the Scholomance. The undead mage Vectus leads a team of Scourge scholars... place Dawn's Gambit in their chamber
column4: called the "viewing room." It will then react with the undead found there and
column5: with a little luck
column6: destroy them! After that
column7: defeating Vectus shouldn't be a problem. Right?

column1: Components for the Enchanted Gold Bloodrobe^34^All^Warlock^Menara Voidrender^Xizk Goodstitch^In Search of Menara Voidrender^^^Bring a Gold Bar to Xizk Goodstitch in Stranglethorn Vale.^Your next task is as simple as your first
column2: but will require you to seek out aid. I require gold thread for the embroidery of the cloak
column3: but gold thread is not easy to come by
column4: and very few know how to make it. Fortunately
column5: one who is loyal to our cause knows its secrets and is willing to help those rising in our ranks. Bring a gold bar to Xizk Goodstitch in Booty Bay. He is a master tailor and will be happy to spin the thread for you. Gold bars are smelted by skilled miners. Ask a miner for help.

column1: Components for the Enchanted Gold Bloodrobe^34^All^Warlock^Xizk Goodstitch^Menara Voidrender^In Search of Menara Voidrender^^^Return to Menara Voidrender in the Barrens.^Return to Menara
column2: tell her it'll take some time
column3: but I'll make sure to come through for her... and you. Tell her to have you finish gathering the rest of your components--I should have the thread done by then. You can return and pick it up then. Good luck
column4: <name>. Oh
column5: and say hello to Strahad for me while you're there. That old coot... putting a tower right there next to Ratchet... crazy.

column1: Components for the Enchanted Gold Bloodrobe^37^All^Warlock^Menara Voidrender^Menara Voidrender^In Search of Menara Voidrender^^Fine Gold Thread^Bring 10 Vials of Hatefury Blood and 1 Lesser Infernal Stone to Menara Voidrender in the Barrens.^The next components are found in Desolace
column2: far to the west of the Barrens and even the Stonetalon Mountains. There
column3: chaos still reigns after the Sundering. Both your strength and cunning will be tested there--you will face creatures of hatred and also of the Burning Legion. From the Hatefury satyr in the northeast
column4: bring me their blood. From the lesser infernals in Mannoroc Coven
column5: bring me a lesser infernal stone. We will use both in the construction of your robe.

column1: Components for the Enchanted Gold Bloodrobe^37^All^Warlock^Menara Voidrender^Menara Voidrender^In Search of Menara Voidrender^^^Bring some Fine Gold Thread
column2: 2 Smoldering Coals
column3: and a Soul Shard to Menara Voidrender in the Barrens.^I need only three things now
column4: <name>
column5: then we can finish your robe. First
column6: the fine gold thread Xizk is making for you. Return to him in Booty Bay and get it. Second
column7: bring me two smoldering coals from the fire elementals in the Arathi Highlands. If I recall correctly
column8: they are to the west
column9: near Thoradin's Wall. Finally
column10: a soul shard created by you. After you have all the components
column11: return here to the tower and I will complete the robe for you.

column1: The Completed Robe^38^All^Warlock^Menara Voidrender^Menara Voidrender^In Search of Menara Voidrender^^^Wait for Menara Voidrender to complete your robe and then speak to her again.^I will put the robe together for you now. It will take but a few moments. Do not go far.

The Ancient Egg^50^All^The Hinterlands^Yeh'kinya^Yeh'kinya^Screecher Spirits^^^Bring the Ancient Egg to Yeh'kinya in Tanaris.^The Prophecy of Mosh'aru speaks of an ancient egg. It is a relic of a time when trolls ruled vast empires
column2: and it has the power to hold the essence of Hakkar. It may be the only way to keep our world safe from his evil. Bring me the ancient egg
column3: <name>. It is said to lay hidden deep within Jintha'Alor in the Hinterlands
column4: in a cave behind the amphitheater at the top of the city.

column1: The Final Tablets^58^All^Blackrock Spire^Prospector Ironboot^Prospector Ironboot^The Lost Tablets of Mosh'aru^^Confront Yeh'kinya^Bring the Fifth and Sixth Mosh'aru Tablets to Prospector Ironboot in Tanaris.^While I look over the third and fourth tablets of Mosh'aru
column2: you must find the fifth and sixth! It will not be easy
column3: for they are held by the Smolderthorn trolls within Blackrock Spire. The spire is a dark mountain of fire between the Burning Steppes and the Searing Gorge. Good luck
column4: <name>. Blackrock Spire is no place for decent folk...

column1: Felnok Steelspring^54^All^Burning Steppes^Tinkee Steamboil^Felnok Steelspring^Broodling Essence^^^Give Tinkee's Letter to Felnok Steelspring at Everlook in Winterspring.^I have another favor to ask of you. My initial study of the essence you collected shows that it might be possible to freeze dragon whelp eggs and preserve them! I want to test this theory
column2: but first I need specially made engineering components. My colleague
column3: Felnok Steelspring
column4: can make them. Here
column5: take this letter to Felnok. It tells him what I need. You'll find Felnok in Winterspring
column6: in the town of Everlook.

column1: Chillwind Horns^54^All^Winterspring^Felnok Steelspring^Felnok Steelspring^Broodling Essence^^^Collect 8 Uncracked Chillwind Horns.^I have most of what Tinkee needs
column2: but I'm missing one important component
column3: and that's chillwind horns. The horns of the chillwind chimaera in Winterspring are a concentrated source of cold
column4: but only pristine
column5: uncracked horns will do! I'll need a supply of those to complete Tinkee's order. Bring me the uncracked chillwind horns
column6: and I'll prepare a package for Tinkee.

column1: Return to Tinkee^54^All^Winterspring^Felnok Steelspring^Tinkee Steamboil^Broodling Essence^^Tinkee Steamboil^Bring Felnok's Package to Tinkee Steamboil at Flame Crest in the Burning Steppes.^Ok
column2: everything is prepared and packed and ready for transport! Good luck in your journey
column3: and make sure you tell Tinkee that she owes me!

column1: The Red Crystal^14^Alliance^Darkshore^Sentinel Glynda Nal'Shea^Sentinel Glynda Nal'Shea^The Red Crystal^^^Travel east of Auberdine and look for a large
column2: red crystal along Darkshore's eastern mountain range. Report back what you find to Sentinel Glynda Nal'Shea in Auberdine.^Hostile moonkin roam in ever increasing numbers to our east. They once were thought to be gentle
column3: almost mystical creatures. While some continue to hold reverence for them
column4: the safety of Auberdine forces me to keep a more realistic view. I've received reports that moonkin are being drawn to a large red crystal along Darkshore's eastern mountain range. No one has any idea what that crystal is
column5: or even if it really exists. I want you to locate it over there and report back to me what you find.

column1: As Water Cascades^14^Alliance^Darkshore^Sentinel Glynda Nal'Shea^Mysterious Red Crystal^The Red Crystal^^^Fill the Empty Water Tube at the Auberdine moonwell
column2: and then investigate the red crystal along Darkshore's eastern mountain wall.^Use this empty vial and fill up on some moonwell water here in Auberdine. Such potent magic should provide a clue as to the composition of the crystal. To do that
column3: you'll pour the liquid over the crystal; it should take care of the rest. While I don't anticipate anything bad happening to you
column4: I still want you to be careful. Above us to the east is Felwood; if that crystal is tied to that place as I suspect it is
column5: then it could prove to be very dangerous.

column1: The Fragments Within^14^All^Darkshore^Mysterious Red Crystal^Sentinel Glynda Nal'Shea^The Red Crystal^^^Report back what you have found to Sentinel Glynda Nal'Shea in Auberdine.^The moonwell water has revealed that embedded inside the crystal are a few small fragments of bone
column2: as well as half of a jawbone. The jawbone appears to be from a humanoid
column3: but it is unclear without breaking open the crystal - a feat that even the strongest of magic would find near impossible. With the task at hand complete
column4: all that remains is to report back to Sentinel Glynda Nal'Shea in Auberdine.

column1: Alien Egg^26^Horde^Thousand Needles^Hagar Lightninghoof^Hagar Lightninghoof^^^Serpent Wild^Return the Alien Egg to Hagar Lightninghoof in Freewind Post.^A rumor has surfaced about an alien egg here in Thousand Needles. Those that report seeing this egg have failed to even get close enough to examine it in detail. Serpents guard the egg as if it's one of their own. I want you to seek out this alien egg and bring it to me so that I may examine it. Reports say the egg is located within a serpent den
column2: but there are several serpent dens along the base of the cliff walls south and northeast of Freewind Post.

column1: Pacify the Centaur^25^Horde^Thousand Needles^Cliffwatcher Longhorn^Cliffwatcher Longhorn^Message to Freewind Post^^^Kill 12 Galak Scouts
column2: 10 Galak Wranglers
column3: and 6 Galak Windchasers
column4: and then return to Cliffwatcher Longhorn in Freewind Post.^<name>
column5: I entreat you to hunt these centaur down. They shall feel the wrath of our revenge. Attack the centaur camp to the north of Freewind Post! Let wrath guide your hand!

column1: Strange Sources^56^All^Winterspring^Donova Snowden^Donova Snowden^Finding the Source^^^Follow Donova Snowden's instructions
column2: then report back.^To tell you the truth
column3: although there are no volcanoes here in Winterspring
column4: I believe that there are far more threatening reasons for these hot springs... Well
column5: I think you'll want to see it for yourself. You'll need to travel the length of Winterspring
column6: and head to the very south. When the air becomes thick and muggy
column7: and the sky turns dark
column8: you'll have found what I believe to be the source of the hot springs. Have a look. I'm sure you'll have many questions when you return.

column1: Enraged Wildkin^59^Alliance^Winterspring^Jaron Stoneshaper^Damaged Crate^Enraged Wildkin^^^Locate Jaron Stoneshaper's wrecked camp and supplies in southern Winterspring.^Hey there
column2: <lad/lass>! I was chased from my camp in southern Winterspring by some bloodthirsty wildkin! Well
column3: I suppose I got too close to something the wildkin were guarding. I barely managed to get away safely; I fear a buddy of mine wasn't as lucky. Would you mind braving the wildkin and heading to the camp? I really need my supplies
column4: and I'd also like to get back the amulet I unearthed yesterday at the dig site.

column1: En-Ay-Es-Tee-Why^59^All^Blackrock Spire^Kibler^Kibler^^^^Travel to Blackrock Spire and collect 15 Spire Spider Eggs for Kibler.^Believe it or not
column2: there are people out there willing to pay for the most vile of domesticated beast! I'd sent Bijou into the Spire to try and collect some of those spire spider eggs but I haven't heard from her in weeks. Maybe you can help me out? I'll tell you what
column3: <name>. Go to Blackrock Spire and collect some spire spider eggs for me. Bring them back here and not only will I give you a little cash
column4: but I'll even domesticate one for you!

column1: Enraged Wildkin^59^Alliance^Winterspring^Damaged Crate^Jaron's Wagon^Enraged Wildkin^^^Find Jaron Stoneshaper's wrecked wagon.^Looking around
column2: you don't see much that Jaron could want here. However
column3: you do notice that the crate you found has been smashed open
column4: almost as if this was what the wildkin were after... Looking to the east
column5: you can barely make out an abandoned wagon. Perhaps you might find Jaron's things there. It's worth a look.

column1: Enraged Wildkin^59^Alliance^Winterspring^Jaron's Wagon^Jaron Stoneshaper^Enraged Wildkin^^^Pick up Jaron's Supplies from the snow
column2: then find the wildkin that stole the amulet Jaron spoke of.^After inspecting the contents of the box
column3: you decide that Jaron could make use of the tools and other items inside. However
column4: there is no sign of the amulet. It appears that the wildkin inhabit the lands to the north and east of here
column5: so you decide that the next step is to face the creatures and reclaim the amulet from them.

column1: Serpent Wild^26^Horde^Thousand Needles^Hagar Lightninghoof^Motega Firemane^Serpent Wild^Alien Egg^^Report your findings to Motega Firemane at Whitereach Post in Thousand Needles.^If I did not see that with my own eyes I would never have believed it to be true. Vengeance has come to Thousand Needles! <Hagar wipes his brow.> <name>
column2: you must act quickly! Go now and seek out Motega Firemane; he is located at Whitereach Post just northwest of Freewind Post along the road. He will know what to do!

column1: Mother's Milk^60^All^Blackrock Spire^Ragged John^Ragged John^^^^In the heart of Blackrock Spire you will find Mother Smolderweb. Engage her and get her to poison you. Chances are good that you will have to kill her as well. Return to Ragged John when you are poisoned so that he can 'milk' you.^It's probably one of the most potent poisons in the world
column2: <race>! I've overheard the Blackrock speaking about its lethality in my jaunts into the Spire. They call it 'Mother's Milk'
column3: named after Mother Smolderweb
column4: the big nasty spider in the Skitterweb cave. Now here's what I need from you: A live sample of the Milk
column5: flowing through YOUR veins. Just bringing me the gland won't be enough! Get her to poison you and come back to me! Then... I get to milk ya! <Rubs his hands together in anticipation.>

column1: Urok Doomhowl^60^All^Blackrock Spire^Warosh^Warosh^^^^Read Warosh's Scroll. Bring Warosh's Mojo to Warosh.^Argh! So hard to speak! Take this note! Get me my mojo!
Assassination Plot^28^Horde^Thousand Needles^Assassination Note^Kanati Greycloud^Assassination Plot^^^Warn Kanati Greycloud at Whitereach Post of the plot to kill him.^The Tauren
column2: Kanati Greycloud is bold to set up a hunting camp in Thousand Needles. We must kill him to rid this hunting camp and all who may follow him. We will converge at the small post Southwest of the Great Lift.

column1: Guarding Secrets^59^Horde^Winterspring^Blue-feathered Necklace^Trull Failbane^Guarding Secrets^^^Take the Blue-feathered Necklace to Trull Failbane at Bloodvenom Post.^You are unsure of the significance of the necklace that fell from the neck of the recently-slain wildkin. It glows brightly
column2: slowly fading in and out. Trull Failbane might be able to tell you more
column3: since his knowledge of the wildkin seems extensive. Perhaps you should ask him about it.

column1: Guarding Secrets^59^Horde^Winterspring^Trull Failbane^Nara Wildmane^Guarding Secrets^^^Take the Blue-feathered Necklace to Nara Wildmane.^While I do possess much knowledge about the owlbeasts you defeated in Winterspring
column2: I am not very learned on the subject of the magics they wield. But I do believe I know of one that would be able to examine the necklace and most likely tell you what it is. Nara Wildmane in Thunder Bluff is an expert in this field; see her. Good luck
column3: <name>.

column1: Guardians of the Altar^59^Alliance^Winterspring^Ranshalla^Erelas Ambersky^^Find Ranshalla^Wildkin of Elune^Protect Ranshalla while she attempts to reactivate the Altar of Elune. Report your findings to Erelas Ambersky in Rut'theran Village.^At the very top of the ridge lies what I believe to be an altar of the goddess Elune. From what I can tell
column2: we need to light the five torches in each cave
column3: and then we will be able to access the altar directly. I transcribed some incantations carved into the stone in the ancient ruins of Kel'Theril
column4: which I believe are the secret to unlocking the altar. I'll need your help to light each torch
column5: while I recite the spell. If we are successful
column6: you'll be able to report our findings to Erelas!

column1: Wildkin of Elune^57^Alliance^Winterspring^Erelas Ambersky^Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm^^Guardians of the Altar^^Speak with Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm in Darnassus.^That's fascinating! I have always wondered about the truth... Well
column2: you must share this knowledge
column3: definitely! Go to Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm right away -- you'll find him in Darnassus
column4: in the Cenarion Circle. Explain to him what happened
column5: just the same as you told me. I'm sure he will be just as interested! This is important information
column6: <name>!

column1: Warlord's Command^60^Horde^Blackrock Spire^Warlord Goretooth^Warlord Goretooth^Warlord's Command^^^Slay Highlord Omokk
column2: War Master Voone
column3: and Overlord Wyrmthalak. Recover Important Blackrock Documents. Return to Warlord Goretooth in Kargath when the mission has been accomplished.^By order of Warlord Goretooth
column4: the following inhabitants of Blackrock Spire must be destroyed: The rotund menace
column5: Highlord Omokk. The cruel and ruthless troll
column6: War Master Voone. Overlord Wyrmthalak
column7: taskmaster of the lesser city. You will also be required to return any important documents that you may find. Succeed and be honored. Fail and be forgotten.

column1: Free at Last^29^Horde^Thousand Needles^Lakota Windsong^Thalia Amberhide^^^^Escort Lakota Windsong from the Darkcloud Pinnacle
column2: and then talk to Thalia Amberhide at Freewind Post.^Arnak thinks we're going to be married... but after I declined his offer he came back that night and kidnapped me. My brother tried to stop him
column3: but Arnak was too strong. He... he slew my brother and then brought me here. My poor brother... <name>
column4: could you escort me out of the Darkcloud Pinnacle? Please... I need to get back to Thalia! She must be worried sick about me.

column1: Further Corruption^54^Alliance^Felwood^Eridan Bluewind^Eridan Bluewind^^The Corruption of the Jadefire^^Eridan Bluewind in Felwood wants you to kill 8 Jadefire Hellcallers
column2: 8 Jadefire Betrayers
column3: 8 Jadefire Tricksters
column4: and Xavaric. Return to Eridan when the task is completed.^A second encampment of satyrs threatens the land of Felwood towards the north
column5: led by the cruel Xavaric. The vile betrayers and tricksters feed upon the corruption of the native creatures of Felwood. Xavathras and his minions were only part of a larger plan -- to cultivate a corrupted moonwell
column6: and then provide the spoils to Xavaric. Now that Xavathras is out of the way
column7: finish this task
column8: <name>. Head to the north and defeat Xavaric.

column1: Tinkee Steamboil^60^All^Blackrock Spire^Felnok Steelspring^Tinkee Steamboil^Tinkee Steamboil^Return to Tinkee^^Speak with Tinkee Steamboil at Flame Crest in the Burning Steppes.^Hi
column2: <name>. Remember Tinkee Steamboil? Well
column3: she remembers you! She sent me a message to keep an eye out for you
column4: because... she needs your help again. I think it has something to do with her studies on dragons. You should speak to her in the Burning Steppes
column5: at the Flame Crest.

column1: Lost in Battle^20^Horde^The Barrens^Mankrik^Mankrik^^^^Find Mankrik's wife and then return to him in the Crossroads.^We battled in a small tauren camp when we were separated--she held three of the Bristlebacks off by herself. But the odds began to overwhelm us. I led some away only to see her overwhelmed by newcomers. In my rage
column2: I turned to face my enemies
column3: but they brought me down easily with their vast numbers. I awoke to a tauren druid tending my wounds--he had come across me on the Gold Road as I fell. Please
column4: <class>
column5: find some sign of my wife.

column1: Eitrigg's Wisdom^60^Horde^Orgrimmar^Warlord Goretooth^Thrall^Warlord's Command^^^Speak with Eitrigg in Orgrimmar. When you have discussed matters with Eitrigg
column2: seek council from Thrall.^Rend lives? Impossible! It had been thought that Rend was slain decades ago. Seek out the wisdom of Eitrigg
column3: <name>. None know the workings of the Blackrock better than he and if what is written here bares truth
column4: Eitrigg should be informed. No person should be denied the right of vengeance. You will find him in Orgrimmar. Once you have spoken with Eitrigg
column5: confer with the Warchief to find out what he wishes to do about this problem.

column1: Cleansing of the Orb of Orahil^40^All^Warlock^Tabetha^Tabetha^Knowledge of the Orb of Orahil^^^Kill the Demon of the Orb
column2: then speak with Tabetha.^Ah
column3: a summoner's orb--this is where the taint must be coming from. We must exorcise the demon within it if you're to use it. That I can do easily. You're the one who has the hard job. You must kill the demon once I release it. And you'll have to be quick. If you take too long then he'll return to the orb and we'll have to start over! So get yourself ready
column4: <name>. Prepare your strongest spells and keep your potions handy
column5: and go get a friend if you have one. Because this isn't going to be pretty.

column1: Shard of a Felhound^40^All^Warlock^Acolyte Wytula^Menara Voidrender^^^^Take the Felhas Ruby and use it on one of the Felhounds found in Desolace. After successful
column2: bring the Felhas Ruby and the Imprisoned Felhound Spirit back to Menara Voidrender in the Barrens.^So
column3: you have chosen to capture the soul of a felhound
column4: good. Take this ruby--with it
column5: you will be able to capture the creature's soul. It works very similar to spells you already know: when the creature is close to dying
column6: use the gem and it should do the rest of the work for you. I would suggest going to Desolace and trying your hand at any of the felhounds there. Those should do nicely. After you're successful
column7: take both the captured spirit and your ruby to Menara.

column1: Shard of an Infernal^40^All^Warlock^Acolyte Magaz^Menara Voidrender^^^^Take the Infus Emerald and use it on one of the Infernals found in Desolace. After successful
column2: bring the Infus Emerald and the Imprisoned Infernal Spirit back to Menara Voidrender in the Barrens.^So
column3: you have chosen to capture the soul of an infernal
column4: good. Take this emerald--with it
column5: you will be able to capture the creature's soul. It works very similar to spells you already know: when the creature is close to dying
column6: use the gem and it should do the rest of the work for you. I would suggest going to Desolace and trying your hand at any of the infernals there. Those should do nicely. After you're successful
column7: take both the captured spirit and your emerald to Menara.

column1: The Completed Orb of Dar'Orahil^40^All^Warlock^Menara Voidrender^Menara Voidrender^^Returning the Cleansed Orb^^Wait for Menara Voidrender to complete the Orb of Dar'Orahil and then speak to her again.^I will get started immediately on crafting your orb and infusing your new demon into it. When done
column2: you will have the choice of having it in the form of a staff or orb. I always felt it was important to cater to a warlock's chosen weapon... I see no reason not to continue that practice.

column1: Knowledge of the Orb of Orahil^35^Alliance^Warlock^Briarthorn^Menara Voidrender^Knowledge of the Orb of Orahil^^^Speak to Menara Voidrender in the Barrens.^Well
column2: well
column3: well... a pleasure to see you're growing in power
column4: <name>. I'd wager you'd be about ready to speak to Menara Voidrender in the Barrens. If you haven't spoken to her before
column5: then let me tell you
column6: I don't think I've ever met another expert in the creation of items--orbs specifically--that can inprison even a demon to serve our will so easily. If you're interested
column7: she's in Strahad's tower above Ratchet in the Barrens.

column1: Protect Kanati Greycloud^28^Horde^Thousand Needles^Kanati Greycloud^Kanati Greycloud^Assassination Plot^^^Protect Kanati Greycloud from the centaur attack.^But
column2: there may be more centaur than I thought
column3: I ask you
column4: <name>
column5: to fight with me against these vile assassins.

column1: Knowledge of the Orb of Orahil^35^Alliance^Warlock^Zevrost^Menara Voidrender^Knowledge of the Orb of Orahil^^^Speak to Menara Voidrender in the Barrens.^Still a fool
column2: and still seeking the trappings of mortals. Yes
column3: I speak to you with arrogance. I see you before me and I laugh. You're pathetic! But it matters not what I think. It only matters what those willing to deal with you thinks! And in this case
column4: against my better judgment
column5: those with some portion of power feel you deserve more. If this is something you strive for then you should speak with Menara Voidrender in the tower above Ratchet. I believe you have met her before some time ago.

column1: Knowledge of the Orb of Orahil^35^All^Warlock^Demisette Cloyce^Menara Voidrender^Knowledge of the Orb of Orahil^^^Speak to Menara Voidrender in the Barrens.^Hmm
column2: you've made it this far... truly astonishing. I would have thought the corruption of channeling the arcane would have seeped into your very soul and driven you mad by now. How about we try and push you further then? If you want to test your skill
column3: seek out Menara Voidrender above Ratchet in Strahad's tower. She will guide you.

column1: Knowledge of the Orb of Orahil^35^Horde^Warlock^Kaal Soulreaper^Menara Voidrender^Knowledge of the Orb of Orahil^^^Speak to Menara Voidrender in the Barrens.^Haha! You're doing very well for yourself
column2: young <class>. Given time
column3: infernals and dreadlords will bow before you! But until that time comes
column4: you must still rely on weapons forged by the hands of the mortal races. You seem prepared for another such creation
column5: and if you are willing
column6: Menara Voidrender would speak with you! She is near Strahad's tower overlooking the port town of Ratchet. Go there when you are ready.

column1: Frostsaber Provisions^60^Alliance^Winterspring^Rivern Frostwind^Rivern Frostwind^^^^Collect 5 Shardtooth Meats and 5 Chillwind Meats for Rivern Frostwind in Winterspring.^If you wish to prove yourself
column2: you may begin by doing a very simple
column3: but very important task. Gather meat from the chimaera and from the shardtooth bears in the area. Bring it to me so that I may use it to feed the frostsabers that are being trained.

column1: A Matter of Time^56^All^Western Plaguelands^Chromie^Chromie^^^Counting Out Time^Use the Temporal Displacer near one of Andorhal's silos and uncover Temporal Parasites.^Tampering of the timeline by a sinister force - most likely the Scourge - has occurred in Andorhal! I can try to keep the passage of time here intact and mend what has been damaged
column2: but I'll need your help to do so uninterrupted. Temporal parasites - carrion that feed on the strands of time's altered flow - now infest the silos of Andorhal. A blue pulse of distortion is their only visual marker. They slow my auguries; please <name>
column3: help me by using this temporal displacer to root out these parasites.

column1: Counting Out Time^56^All^Western Plaguelands^Chromie^Chromie^^A Matter of Time^Counting Out Time^Locate 5 Andorhal Watches
column2: found in lockboxes amongst the rubble of the city. Return with them to Chromie in the Andorhal Inn
column3: Western Plaguelands.^I need you to reach into the world beyond this room
column4: <name>. Allow me to explain. You see the difference in this room compared to the rest of Andorhal. My dragonflight works in many different ways and in many different timelines. To mend Andorhal's damage
column5: I now act from a different timeline as not to overly contaminate it. To continue this though I need time trinkets
column6: ones trapped from when the plague hit. Find them in lockboxes found in the ruined buildings that make up this once proud city.

column1: Counting Out Time^56^All^Western Plaguelands^Chromie^Chromie^^Counting Out Time^^Locate 5 Andorhal Watches amongst the rubble of the city
column2: and return with them to Chromie in the Andorhal Inn
column3: Western Plaguelands.^If you are willing to help once more
column4: I can certainly use your assistance. I'll gladly take more watches you might uncover from the ruins of Andorhal. They certainly help me in maintaining a balance against whatever malign force is meddling with the timeline here. In exchange for those watches
column5: I'll give you another item that
column6: in the future
column7: I suspect you'll find quite the use for.

column1: For The Horde!^60^Horde^Blackrock Spire^Thrall^Thrall^Warlord's Command^^What the Wind Carries^Travel to Blackrock Spire and slay Warchief Rend Blackhand. Take his head and return to Orgrimmar.^Rend dares make such grand claims because of the protection he is afforded by the black flight. You
column2: <name>
column3: will find a way to pass through the Halls of Ascension. You will then find 'Warchief' Rend Blackhand and you will destroy him - FOR THE HORDE! <Thrall slams a fist down upon his throne.> The next time you return to my chambers
column4: you will hold his head high in triumph and then you shall present it to your Warchief. Do this and be honored as a hero of the Horde.

column1: The Completed Orb of Noh'Orahil^40^All^Warlock^Menara Voidrender^Menara Voidrender^^Returning the Cleansed Orb^^Wait for Menara Voidrender to complete the Orb of Noh'Orahil and then speak to her again.^I will get started immediately on crafting your orb and infusing your new demon into it. When done
column2: you will have the choice of having it in the form of a staff or orb. I always felt it was important to cater to a warlock's chosen weapon... I see no reason not to continue that practice.

column1: Returning the Cleansed Orb^40^All^Warlock^Tabetha^Menara Voidrender^Knowledge of the Orb of Orahil^^The Completed Orb of Dar'Orahil
column2: The Completed Orb of Noh'Orahil^Return the Cleansed Infernal Orb to Menara Voidrender in the Barrens.^Take the cleansed orb back to Menara in Ratchet
column3: <name>. Give her my regards and be safe. I truly hope you are able to withstand the temptation and corruption that is sure to come as you follow your path. Good luck.

column1: Operative Bijou^59^All^Blackrock Spire^Lexlort^Bijou^Operative Bijou^^^Travel to Blackrock Spire and find out what happened to Bijou.^Never trust a goblin. That's what it comes down to
column2: <name>. Bijou is her name - one of our slipperiest operatives. I found out she was working for some shady exotic pet dealer out of the Burning Steppes named Kibler
column3: in essence
column4: two timing us. Worse yet
column5: she was using Horde funds to finance her operations. I want her brought back here alive. She was last seen entering Blackrock Spire. Find her and bring her back. And <name>
column6: do not let her sweet talk you.

column1: Bijou's Belongings^59^Horde^Blackrock Spire^Bijou^Bijou^Operative Bijou^^^Find Bijou's Belongings and return them to her. You recall her mentioning that she stashed them on the bottom floor of the city.^At night when this place is lightly guarded
column2: I sneak around the city
column3: taking notes and writing down anything I see that could be of some strategic value to the K.E.F. Last night
column4: however
column5: things went dreadfully wrong. I stumbled across a tripwire and set off an alarm. I stashed my recon gear and ran for cover! Unfortunately
column6: I can't get back to that gear. They've doubled and tripled up the patrols! All that information is lost. Get my belongings back and I'll return to the K.E.F. peacefully.

column1: Bijou's Reconnaissance Report^59^All^Blackrock Spire^Bijou^Lexlort^Operative Bijou^^^Take Bijou's Reconnaissance Report back to Grandmaster Lexlort in Kargath.^Take this report back to Lexlort. It will redeem my good name and will surely give the K.E.F. a strategic advantage in dealing with these orcs. Come with you? I've got way too much work to do. Get going
column2: they need these reports as soon as possible!

column1: The Wildlife Suffers Too^54^All^Western Plaguelands^Mulgris Deepriver^Mulgris Deepriver^The Wildlife Suffers Too^^^Destroy 8 Diseased Wolves
column2: and then return to Mulgris Deepriver at the Writhing Haunt
column3: Western Plaguelands.^While there was little I could do alone to thwart the Scourge
column4: I nevertheless came to these lands to try and heal the damage done to nature. Animals suffer from the plague that continues to choke these lands
column5: unable to find mercy and peace. I ask for you to continue what I could not finish here. There is no salvation for the suffering animals but a sweet and merciful release. Seek out diseased wolves nearby and put them down. Please <name>
column6: end their misery - doing so will surely soothe mine.

column1: The Wildlife Suffers Too^56^All^Western Plaguelands^Mulgris Deepriver^Mulgris Deepriver^The Wildlife Suffers Too^^Glyphed Oaken Branch
column2: Glyphed Oaken Branch^Destroy 8 Diseased Grizzlies
column3: and then return to Mulgris Deepriver at the Writhing Haunt
column4: Western Plaguelands.^To the east of where we are
column5: near where the Eastern Plaguelands begin
column6: once proud and majestic grizzlies roamed the countryside. The plague released by the Scourge has sundered these beasts too. They wander the countryside
column7: agonized by the stiffening of their muscles and the rotting of their fur and flesh. I ask of you to end their misery as well. The only cure for their suffering is a swift death
column8: one that must be ministered by your hand.

column1: Glyphed Oaken Branch^56^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Mulgris Deepriver^Mathrengyl Bearwalker^^The Wildlife Suffers Too^^Based on the magic enchanted within the Glyphed Oaken Branch
column2: its delivery to the Cenarion Circle in Darnassus is the next step the tauren druid sought. Seek one of the druids there for assistance.^The lifeless hand of the tauren druid clutches a surprisingly healthy looking oaken branch. Examining the branch reveals glyphs of a druidic nature carved into the bark. As you grasp the branch
column3: you notice it is warm to the touch
column4: more than it should be. The image of the Teldrassil tree enters your mind - Darnassus specifically - and the words "Cenarion Circle" are on the tip of your tongue. It would appear that the suggestion of where to take the branch has been placed within it.

column1: Glyphed Oaken Branch^56^Horde^Western Plaguelands^Mulgris Deepriver^Nara Wildmane^^The Wildlife Suffers Too^^Based on the magic enchanted within the Glyphed Oaken Branch
column2: its delivery to the Cenarion Circle in Thunder Bluff is the next step the tauren druid sought. Seek one of the druids there for assistance.^The lifeless hand of the tauren druid clutches a surprisingly healthy looking oaken branch. Examining the branch reveals glyphs of a druidic nature carved into the bark. As you grasp the branch
column3: you notice it is warm to the touch
column4: more than it should be. The image of Thunder Bluff in Mulgore enters your mind - Elder Rise specifically - and the words "Cenarion Circle" are on the tip of your tongue. It would appear that the suggestion of where to take the branch has been placed within it.

column1: Bijou's Belongings^59^Alliance^Blackrock Spire^Bijou^Bijou^Bijou's Belongings^^^Find Bijou's Belongings and return them to her. Good luck!^Ordinarily I don't deal with <race>s but it seems that I'm stuck between a troll and a hard place. You see
column2: my mission here is one of utmost importance to the Horde. The information I've discovered
column3: however
column4: applies to the well being of the Alliance as well. Now believe me
column5: I'm no Alliance sympathizer
column6: but the Blackrock threat is bigger than just a bunch of orcs. You help me out by finding my belongings and I'll help you out with some information that could prove useful to your kind. Deal?

column1: Message to Maxwell^59^All^Blackrock Spire^Bijou^Marshal Maxwell^Bijou's Belongings^^^Travel to the Burning Steppes and give Bijou's Information to Marshal Maxwell.^I'm a goblin of my word
column2: <race>. Now listen closely: These orcs are used primarily as beasts of burden and cannon fodder for the black dragonflight! Their true leader is none other than Nefarian
column3: brood of Deathwing. I've also discovered the location of Nefarian's subordinates in this part of the citadel. Take this map to Marshal Maxwell in the Burning Steppes. It has the location of these fiends marked for easy identification.

column1: Better Late Than Never^52^All^Western Plaguelands^Janice Felstone^Janice's Parcel^^^Better Late Than Never
column2: Better Late Than Never^The ramblings of the ghostly woman indicated that she needed a package delivered. She claimed that it was where her horse was. As to where the horse is or where the package was to be delivered - the ghost remains incomprehensible.^"The package must be delivered... delivered before I'm trapped here!" The cries of a panicked woman feel almost like a whisper floating through the house. Cowered in the upstairs corner is the apparition of a woman. She does not seem to be fully cognizant of her surroundings
column3: and she is only vaguely aware of you. "Are you here to deliver my package? Please
column4: before it gets much worse! I was going to ride out of here. It should still be by my horse... or am I too late?"

column1: Better Late Than Never^52^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Janice's Parcel^Royal Factor Bathrilor^Better Late Than Never^Better Late Than Never^^Check with the Royal Factors of Stormwind to learn the whereabouts of an Emma Felstone. There is usually a census officer located in City Hall.^You pick up the package
column2: wiping off a small layer of dust and grime that had settled on it. It is addressed in a hurried hand to an Emma Felstone of Stormwind; the delivery of the package is dated for well over four years ago. Though it is unclear if Emma Felstone is even alive
column3: it is widely known that the Stormwind City Hall keep records on the populace of the city. This is handled through the Royal Factors of the Stormwind Census.

column1: Better Late Than Never^52^Horde^Western Plaguelands^Janice's Parcel^Royal Overseer Bauhaus^Better Late Than Never^Better Late Than Never^^Check with the Royal Overseers of the Undercity to learn the whereabouts of a Jeremiah Felstone. There is usually a census officer located near guild and tabard registration.^You pick up the package
column2: wiping off a small layer of dust and grime that had settled on it. It is addressed in a hurried hand to a Jeremiah Felstone of Lordaeron; the delivery of the package is dated for well over four years ago. Though it is unclear if Jeremiah Felstone is even alive
column3: it is widely known that the Undercity
column4: formerly known as Lordaeron
column5: keeps records on the populace of the city. This is handled through the Royal Overseers of the Undercity Census.

column1: Supplies for the Crossroads^14^Horde^The Barrens^Thork^Thork^^Disrupt the Attacks^^Find and return Crossroads' Supply Crates to Thork in the Barrens.^That attack on the caravan contained supplies we desperately needed. You've been brave enough to take on the Razormane tribe so far
column2: and I will ask you to do so again
column3: but this time
column4: I wonder if I could ask you to keep your eyes open for some of our lost supplies. You can probably find them throughout their camps
column5: the quilboar getting fat off their dishonorable acts. The people of the Crossroads would be in your debt.

column1: Finkle Einhorn
column2: At Your Service!^60^All^Blackrock Spire^Finkle Einhorn^Malyfous Darkhammer^^^Cap of the Scarlet Savant
column3: Leggings of Arcana
column4: Breastplate of Bloodthirst^Talk to Malyfous Darkhammer in Everlook.^You'll find Malyfous Darkhammer in Everlook
column5: <class>. Tell him that 'Finkle is A-OK' and that the suit works perfectly. Then hand him this: <Finkle hands you a glowing piece of flesh.> I snatched it from the beast's innards during my 'vacation.' I bet Malyfous could give you a fairly accurate assessment of what he can do with parts from a monster like this! Oh
column6: I suppose you don't know where Everlook is
column7: do you? To Winterspring
column8: <fella/lady>!

column1: Good Natured Emma^52^Alliance^Stormwind City^Royal Factor Bathrilor^Ol' Emma^Better Late Than Never^^Good Luck Charm^Find Ol' Emma in Stormwind and see if she is in fact Emma Felstone. If she is
column2: then perhaps she'd like the package Janice Felstone made for her.^She's a tad ornery
column3: and quite possibly out of her gourd... but the records indicate that Ol' Emma does fit the framework of who Emma Felstone might be. Perhaps you've seen Ol' Emma wander the city - she talks to herself
column4: most often in nonsensical jibber-jabber. Still
column5: she doesn't hurt anything or anyone
column6: so folks pretty much leave her be. All things considered
column7: I would say that Ol' Emma is in fact Emma Felstone. You might try asking if her last name is indeed Felstone.

column1: The Jeremiah Blues^52^Horde^Undercity^Royal Overseer Bauhaus^Jeremiah Payson^Better Late Than Never^^Good Luck Charm^Find Jeremiah Payson in the Undercity and see if he is in fact Jeremiah Felstone. If he is
column2: then perhaps he'd like the package Janice Felstone made for him.^From the evidence I am able to muster
column3: the person you seek - and the intended recipient of the parcel - is Jeremiah Payson
column4: the Undercity cockroach vendor. I've always been of the opinion that it takes a special gift to sell... cockroaches. No doubt you are on quite the epic sojourn now
column5: mighty <class>. I will leave you to your world-shaping endeavors. Allow me
column6: however
column7: to be a part of your magnum opus and reveal that he is located near the bank
column8: suitably groveling under one of the walkways.

column1: Good Luck Charm^52^All^Western Plaguelands^Ol' Emma^Janice Felstone^Better Late Than Never^^^Return to Janice Felstone in Western Plaguelands her Good Luck Half-Charm.^It would seem that I was wrong about you <name>
column2: and for that I owe you an apology. My sister sent me a number of personal effects
column3: including humorously enough the deed to the Felstone farm. I think I'll pass on reclaiming it right now. If my sister's spirit remains tethered to the farm and cannot rest
column4: please... could you return this to her? It is half of a good luck charm she had
column5: with her husband having the other half. Maybe her knowing I have these things will now put her soul to rest.

column1: Two Halves Become One^54^All^Western Plaguelands^Janice Felstone^Janice Felstone^Better Late Than Never^^^Locate the other half of the Good Luck Charm somewhere on the Felstone Farm in Western Plaguelands and reassemble it.^The ramblings of the poor ghost continue: "I'm so cold
column2: John. Bring me your charm
column3: and we'll be together! Quickly John
column4: before the plague comes to change us into hideous beasts! I can't see you John... but I know you're near. I feel you near me." Perhaps if the second half of the charm was found and reassembled
column5: this would constitute what the spirit of Janice Felstone is seeking.

column1: Blood Shards of Agamaggan^21^Horde^The Barrens^Mangletooth^Mangletooth^^Tribes at War^Betrayal from Within
column2: Spirit of the Wind
column3: Agamaggan's Strength
column4: Agamaggan's Agility
column5: Wisdom of Agamaggan
column6: Rising Spirit
column7: Razorhide^Bring a Blood Shard to Mangletooth in Camp Taurajo in the Barrens.^Along with the thorns
column8: the blood affected other aspects of the earth: blood red stones mixed in with other minerals. The Bristleback dig up these shards and carry them as totems for strength in battle and as totems for their magics. I know the secrets of that magic. Bring Mangletooth one of these blood shards to show you understand. Bring Mangletooth many of the shards
column9: and he will bless you with quilboar magic--the magic of Agamaggan!

column1: Ursius of the Shardtooth^56^All^Winterspring^Storm Shadowhoof^Storm Shadowhoof^Ursius of the Shardtooth^^^Storm Shadowhoof at Everlook in Winterspring wants you to kill Ursius.^In the snowy mountains of Winterspring
column2: to the northwest
column3: a skilled hunter stalks his prey... I speak of Ursius of the shardtooth bears
column4: an agile and clever beast. I send you now against him. He roams the sloping hills to the northwest of Everlook. Find and hunt him
column5: before he discovers your intent. All that have gone up against Ursius have quickly found themselves to be the prey
column6: and he
column7: the hunter. Stay on your guard.

column1: Brumeran of the Chillwind^58^All^Winterspring^Storm Shadowhoof^Storm Shadowhoof^Ursius of the Shardtooth^^^Storm Shadowhoof at Everlook in Winterspring wants you to kill Brumeran.^Swift
column2: and clever
column3: Brumeran glides silently across the snowy landscape of southern Winterspring. But do not let her graceful appearance convince you that she is harmless. All that cross her pay considerably
column4: and often with their own lives. Seek out Brumeran of the chillwind among the chimera. Defeat her
column5: then return again to me.

column1: Shy-Rotam^60^All^Winterspring^Storm Shadowhoof^Storm Shadowhoof^Ursius of the Shardtooth^^Past Endeavors^Storm Shadowhoof at Everlook in Winterspring wants you to defeat Shy-Rotam.^In northern Winterspring
column2: great cats assemble around a large landmark called Frostsaber Rock. The leader of these cats is known by the name Shy-Rotam. Defeating the matriarch of the frostsabers would grant you much respect in the eyes of your fellow <race>. Go again to the harsh wilds
column3: and once there
column4: gather sacred meat from the frostsabers. Find the stone of Shy-Rotam
column5: and place it there. Placing the meat of her kin before her will summon Shy-Rotam
column6: in anger. Be ready for her fury
column7: and defeat her.

column1: Past Endeavors^60^All^Winterspring^Storm Shadowhoof^Storm Shadowhoof^^Shy-Rotam^^Bring Storm Shadowhoof's Marker to Melor Stonehoof in Thunder Bluff.^Before you spoke to me
column2: <name>
column3: I had heard of your endeavors... that you had an unyielding desire to prove yourself
column4: that you had an exceptional ability as a <class>
column5: and I now know these things to be the truth. Those that excel as you do are worthy of recognition. Take this marker to a friend of mine in Thunder Bluff named Melor Stonehoof. I'm sure he will remember you
column6: and what you accomplished so long ago. Speak to him of you recent victories
column7: and do not ever forget what you have accomplished today.

column1: Aquatic Form^16^Night Elf^Druid^Dendrite Starblaze^Mathrengyl Bearwalker^A Lesson to Learn^^^Return to Darnassus and show Mathrengyl Bearwalker the Pendant of the Sea Lion.^You have completed the necessary lessons all young druids are taught before they can adopt an aquatic aspect. Go now back to your trainer
column2: Mathrengyl Bearwalker
column3: in Darnassus. Show him your pendant and prove to him you are ready to learn what he has to teach you. He will complete your training
column4: allowing you to become one with the water. Goodbye
column5: young druid. We shall speak again.

column1: Sacred Fire^27^Horde^Thousand Needles^Motega Firemane^Magatha Grimtotem^Serpent Wild^^Arikara^Gather 10 bushels of Incendia Agave
column2: and then consult Magatha Grimtotem on Elder Rise in Thunderbluff.^Arikara is a deadly creature that must be dealt with swiftly. In order to hunt her down you will need to light the sacred fire of life - this will summon Arikara. Go now and harvest the rare Incendia agave plant. Once you have harvested enough agave
column3: seek council with Magatha Grimtotem on Elder Rise in Thunder Bluff. She is a powerful shaman that can enchant the agave plant to create a powder that will light the fire. Travel northeast to the Boiling Pool and gather Incendia Agave.

column1: Cap of the Scarlet Savant^60^All^Winterspring^Malyfous's Catalogue^Malyfous Darkhammer^^Finkle Einhorn
column2: At Your Service!^^In order to create the Cap of the Scarlet Savant
column3: you will be required to bring the following items back to Malyfous Darkhammer: 1 Pristine Hide of the Beast; 5 Frayed Abomination Stitchings; 8 Arcane Crystals; 5 Enchanted Scarlet Thread.^A finer cap you may never see. From the pristine hide of the beast
column4: our expert crafters will create the most phenomenal hat a prestidigitator could ever hope to don! Fifty gold pieces along with the listed items and your head shall be graced with the Cap of the Scarlet Savant: *The pristine hide of the Beast. *Frayed abomination stitchings. *Arcane crystals. *Enchanted scarlet thread. BEHOLD!

column1: Grimtotem Spying^28^Horde^Thousand Needles^Cliffwatcher Longhorn^Cliffwatcher Longhorn^Message to Freewind Post^^^Locate and retrieve the three Secret Notes in Darkcloud Pinnacle.^<name>
column2: you have served us well in the past
column3: so I now entrust to you an important mission. The Grimtotem Clan is up to something secretive. Three agents of unknown origin were seen visiting the Grimtotem over the recent weeks. We discovered that separate chests in Darkcloud Pinnacle hold these guarded messages. <name>
column4: if you succeed in this dangerous mission
column5: I will reward you in kind.

column1: The Lost Tablets of Mosh'aru^58^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Prospector Ironboot^Prospector Ironboot^The Lost Tablets of Mosh'aru^The God Hakkar^^Bring the Third and Fourth Mosh'aru Tablets to Prospector Ironboot in Tanaris.^The troll with whom you spoke did not tell the truth. The two tablets you gained for him spoke of containing the essence of Hakkar
column2: but there is more to that legend. I have studied long
column3: and found that there are six Tablets of Mosh'aru
column4: not two! Six! And I fear that we will not like what secrets the others hold.. Find the third and fourth tablets of Mosh'aru. They're in the Eastern Plaguelands
column5: held by the mossflayer trolls. Find them
column6: and bring them to me.

column1: A Call to Arms: The Plaguelands!^50^Alliance^Stormwind City^Crier Goodman^Commander Ashlam Valorfist^A Call to Arms: The Plaguelands!^^^Seek out Commander Ashlam Valorfist. His base camp is located at Chillwind Camp
column2: north of the Alterac Mountains.^Hear ye
column3: hear ye! All heroes are called upon to heed these words! A call to arms has been issued by the Kingdom of Stormwind! All able bodied individuals are entreated to take up arms against the dark threat of the Scourge in the northern lands of the Eastern Kingdoms! Rumors fly of new threats rising from the ruins of the Plaguelands! Heroes of the realm - seek out Commander Ashlam Valorfist who has set up his base camp in Chillwind Camp
column4: north of the Alterac Mountains!

column1: Leggings of Arcana^60^All^Winterspring^Malyfous's Catalogue^Malyfous Darkhammer^^Finkle Einhorn
column2: At Your Service!^^In order to create the Leggings of Arcana
column3: you will be required to bring the following items back to Malyfous Darkhammer: 1 Pristine Hide of the Beast; 5 Frayed Abomination Stitchings; 5 Arcanite Bars; 5 Frostwhisper's Embalming Fluid.^While the crafting of such an item has never successfully been accomplished
column4: it is thought to be possible - under the right circumstance. Should the seeker of arcanum desire to imbue leggings with immense power
column5: the following they must find: * The pristine hide of the Beast. * Frayed abomination stitchings. *Arcanite Bars. *Frostwhisper's embalming fluid. BEHOLD!

column1: Breastplate of Bloodthirst^60^All^Winterspring^Malyfous's Catalogue^Malyfous Darkhammer^^Finkle Einhorn
column2: At Your Service!^^In order to create the Breastplate of Bloodthirst
column3: you will be required to bring the following items back to Malyfous Darkhammer: 1 Pristine Hide of the Beast; 10 Frayed Abomination Stitchings; 5 Arcanite Bars; 5 Skin of Shadow.^It is said that only one Breastplate of Bloodthirst has ever been created and that it was made for the legendary assassin
column4: Garona. Whether this world will ever see another is doubtful. Regardless! Our master crafters can reproduce the item given the necessary components: *The pristine hide of the Beast. *Frayed abomination stitchings. *Arcanite bars. *The skin of shadow. BEHOLD!

column1: Maxwell's Mission^60^Alliance^Blackrock Spire^Marshal Maxwell^Marshal Maxwell^Bijou's Belongings^^^Travel to Blackrock Spire and destroy War Master Voone
column2: Highlord Omokk
column3: and Overlord Wyrmthalak.^This information fills in the gaps to our otherwise impeccable intelligence of Blackrock Spire. The attack must be decisive
column4: <name>. First their war master
column5: the troll Voone
column6: must be destroyed. Without his battle plans
column7: the Blackrock orcs will be thrown into chaos. You must then take out the ogre Highlord
column8: Omokk. The cowardly ogres of Blackrock are powerless without his leadership. Lastly
column9: the overlord of the citadel: Wyrmthalak. With Wyrmthalak dead
column10: their central command unit is without a conduit.

column1: Threat of the Winterfall^56^All^Winterspring^Donova Snowden^Donova Snowden^Trouble in Winterspring!^^^Donova Snowden in Winterspring wants you to kill 8 Winterfall Pathfinders
column2: 8 Winterfall Den Watchers
column3: and 8 Winterfall Totemics.^I came to Winterspring to investigate the Frostfire Hot Springs. I've noticed that the water seems to have ...strange qualities. I haven't yet been able to discover the source
column4: and to tell you the truth
column5: I've had some difficulty lately
column6: due to the Winterfall furbolg. They seem to be drawn to the springs
column7: just as I am. They have become extremely protective of the water
column8: and won't let me come near the two larger springs to the north of here. I'd like to continue my studies
column9: so won't you help me?

column1: Winterfall Firewater^56^All^Winterspring^Empty Firewater Flask^Donova Snowden^Winterfall Firewater^^^Bring the Empty Firewater Flask to Donova Snowden in Winterspring.^This vial that you picked up from the Winterfall furbolg is empty
column2: but you can detect a few drops of a strange green liquid inside; it almost glows. Is it something important? Donova Snowden would probably be able to tell you more
column3: since she has been camped by the hot springs in Winterspring for some time now.

column1: Falling to Corruption^56^All^Winterspring^Donova Snowden^Deadwood Cauldron^Winterfall Firewater^^^Search the Deadwood furbolg camp in northern Felwood for a clue.^This greenish liquid... it reminds me a bit of the sludge I saw when traveling through Felwood. And I have seen some Winterfall Runners passing into Timbermaw... Perhaps these things have something to do with the flask you found
column2: <name>. There is a large group of furbolg just past Timbermaw Hold
column3: in Felwood. Called the Deadwood tribe
column4: they have been corrupted and driven mad by the fel. Why don't you look around there and see if you can find any evidence of dealings between the Winterfall and the Deadwood?

column1: Mystery Goo^56^All^Winterspring^Deadwood Cauldron^Donova Snowden^Winterfall Firewater^^^Report back to Donova Snowden with your findings.^The greenish substance inside the cauldron appears to be similar to what you found in the flask. This strange gooey stuff could be as corrupted as the furbolg that created it... If the Winterfall furbolg are using it
column2: does this mean that they will soon be as corrupted as the Deadwood tribe? It would be best to report back to Donova with your findings
column3: along with a sample of the liquid in the cauldron.

column1: Toxic Horrors^56^All^Winterspring^Donova Snowden^Donova Snowden^Winterfall Firewater^^^Collect 3 Toxic Horror Droplets for Donova Snowden in Winterspring.^I've studied the sample you returned with
column2: and while I can't say for sure
column3: I believe it contains traces of toxic elements. However
