column4: the only way to know for sure is to gather some as a comparison. I believe that the Deadwood furbolg may be gathering these elements from other corrupted creatures in Felwood; in particular
column5: the elementals living in the Irontree Woods
column6: called toxic horrors. Collect a few samples for me to compare
column7: but be careful -- it's very dangerous there!

column1: Winterfall Runners^57^All^Winterspring^Donova Snowden^Donova Snowden^Winterfall Firewater^^The Final Piece^Find the Winterfall Runners and stop them from delivering their shipment to Winterfall Village.^Very interesting
column2: <name>... When this toxic substance is mixed with the water from the hot springs
column3: it loses its toxicity
column4: only retaining the ability to temporarily affect those that ingest it. This must be why the Winterfall protect the hot springs so fervently -- they need them to purify their firewater. We need to stop this -- cut off contact between the Winterfall and the Deadwood. A group of runners walks the distance between their village and Felwood. Find and defeat them
column5: and steal their shipment.

column1: Arikara^28^Horde^Thousand Needles^Magatha Grimtotem^Motega Firemane^^Sacred Fire^^Slay Arikara. Bring her remains and the Incendia powder to Motega Firemane in Whitereach Post as proof of your deed.^Take this refined and purified Incendia powder to Thousand Needles and toss it on the sacred fire of life. It is located in the Darkcloud Pinnacle on an isolated needle where they bury their dead. The enchantment that I have weaved into the Incendia powder will summon Arikara to you
column2: <name>. I fear she may be stalking Cairne Bloodhoof; too much Tauren lore has changed
column3: and I fear this has angered Arikara. Move quickly before all is lost
column4: <class>!

column3: concerning protocol. Your instinct tells you that you should take it to Marshal Maxwell.

column1: Clear the Way^52^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Commander Ashlam Valorfist^Commander Ashlam Valorfist^A Call to Arms: The Plaguelands!^^All Along the Watchtowers
column2: The Scourge Cauldrons^Kill 10 Skeletal Flayers and 10 Slavering Ghouls in Sorrow Hill.^With Andorhal's western and northern roads into the city well fortified
column3: I'm looking to strike at it from the less defended eastern road. The Scourge relies on the buffer of undead that infests Sorrow Hill as a first line of defense. If we are to advance on Andorhal
column4: we will need to do it through Sorrow Hill. Your first assignment will be to clear the way through Sorrow Hill. Thin out the skeletons and ghouls that haunt the area; report back to me when this is done!

column1: A Call to Arms: The Plaguelands!^50^Horde^Western Plaguelands^Warcaller Gorlach^High Executor Derrington^A Call to Arms: The Plaguelands!^^^Seek out High Executor Derrington. His base camp is located at the Bulwark
column2: east of Tirisfal Glade and the Undercity.^Heroes of the realm
column3: hear me - the Horde calls upon you for swift action! A call to arms has been issued for all able bodied individuals to take up arms against the Scourge! Rumors fly of new threats rising from the ruins of the Eastern Kingdoms. They loom to the east of the Undercity
column4: in the northern reaches of the lands now known as the Plaguelands! Heroes of the realm - seek out High Executor Derrington
column5: who has set up his base camp at the Bulwark
column6: east of Tirisfal Glade!

column1: Scarlet Diversions^53^Horde^Western Plaguelands^High Executor Derrington^High Executor Derrington^A Call to Arms: The Plaguelands!^^All Along the Watchtowers
column2: The Scourge Cauldrons^Proceed to the Scarlet Crusade's base camp between Felstone Field and Dalson's Tears and destroy their command tent.^Before Andorhal
column3: we must tackle the advancing Scarlet Crusade menace from Hearthglen. They've made camp between Felstone Field and Dalson's Tears
column4: making us risk conflict against both the Scourge and the Crusade at once. My plan is to play them off of each other by sending you to destroy the command tent they've set up; use some Flame in a Bottle from this box of incendiaries. Once razed
column5: plant this Scourge banner by the tent. With some luck
column6: they'll ignore us and focus on the Scourge for vengeance.

column1: All Along the Watchtowers^56^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Commander Ashlam Valorfist^Commander Ashlam Valorfist^^Clear the Way^Alas
column2: Andorhal
column3: Scholomance^Using the Beacon Torch
column4: mark each tower in Andorhal; you will need to stand in the doorway of the tower to successfully mark it.^Through the use of a magical device known as a beacon torch
column5: we can mark targets of our choosing for future actions by our troops. To that end
column6: we think the Scourge are using Andorhal's watchtowers as a means to control their troop movements. Your mission: breach Andorhal's defenses to plant beacons at all four watchtowers. You'll need to be in the doorway of each tower to plant the beacon; it will then proceed to mark the tower. There are only five charges on the beacon torch
column7: so use them wisely!

column1: General Drakkisath's Demise^60^Alliance^Blackrock Spire^Marshal Maxwell^Marshal Maxwell^General Drakkisath's Command^^^Travel to Blackrock Spire and slay General Drakkisath.^We battle against these beasts on two fronts: From our capital of Stormwind we fight them from the inside out and here
column2: in the Burning Steppes
column3: we take the battle to their doorstep. We must be vigilant
column4: <name>. None should be spared our wrath as none of our own were spared when they struck at our homes and families. Find this General Drakkisath and destroy him! The task certainly will not be a simple one
column5: but the rewards shall be extravagant.

column1: Hot Fiery Death^60^All^Blacksmithing^Human Remains^Malyfous Darkhammer^Hot Fiery Death^^^Someone in this world must know what to do with these gauntlets. Good luck!^The only thing that remains of this human are some charred bones. He seems to have died within arms reach of what he was after - unfired plate gauntlets. Perhaps you should grab the gauntlets and get out of the fire?

High Chief Winterfall^59^All^Winterspring^Donova Snowden^Donova Snowden^Winterfall Firewater^^^Donova Snowden in Winterspring wants you to defeat High Chief Winterfall.^While we still know very little about why the furbolg have been ingesting this strange substance
column2: I do think it's best that we put a stop to it before it gets out of hand. The Winterfall furbolg are not a normally aggressive tribe
column3: and this change in their behavior leads me to think that they must be under orders from their chief. We most likely can't undo the damage that has already been done
column4: but I think that if their leader is slain
column5: they will not get any worse. Head east to Winterfall Village.

column1: The Final Piece^59^All^Winterspring^Crudely-written Log^Donova Snowden^^Winterfall Runners^Words of the High Chief^Bring the Crudely-written Log to Donova Snowden in Winterspring.^The log you found on the high chief looks extensive
column2: but after looking through a couple of the pages
column3: you find that you cannot read the text. The markings are so crude and poorly-formed that you are not sure if anyone would be able to read them. But perhaps Donova will be able to tell you what it says...

column1: The Final Piece^59^All^Winterspring^Crudely-written Log^Donova Snowden^^Winterfall Runners^Words of the High Chief^Bring the Crudely-written Log to Donova Snowden in Winterspring.^The log you found on the high chief looks extensive

column1: Lorax's Tale^60^All^Winterspring^Lorax^Lorax^^^The Demon Forge^Speak with Lorax. Listen to what he has to say.^The Satyr paces about and talks to himself. Do you wish to question him?

The Demon Forge^60^All^Blackrock Spire^Lorax^Lorax^^Lorax's Tale^^Travel to Blackrock Spire and find Goraluk Anvilcrack. Slay him and then use the Blood Stained Pike upon his corpse. After his soul has been siphoned
column2: the pike will be Soul Stained.^Lorax makes deals
column3: he does not accept them from insignificant mortals. A deal I shall make with you
column4: however... take this pike
column5: it is imbued with powerful Fel energies. When you find Goraluk Anvilcrack
column6: slay him and drive this pike through his dying heart. His soul he bartered
column7: his soul I shall have. Return the pike and return the breastplate that the thief stole and I shall teach you what it is that he was to learn.

column1: Words of the High Chief^59^All^Winterspring^Donova Snowden^Kelek Skykeeper^^The Final Piece^^Take the Crudely-written Log to Kelek Skykeeper in southern Felwood.^The Winterfall are no longer a threat to me
column2: but if you still want to find out what was driving the furbolg to create and consume this strange firewater
column3: I think you should seek out Kelek Skykeeper. He is part of a group known as the Emerald Circle
column4: druids that are committed to their work in Felwood
column5: healing the land from the corruption. Kelek has much experience with the furbolgs in Felwood
column6: and may be able to tell you more about the log. Thank you
column7: again
column8: <name>.

column1: Dragonscale Leatherworking^55^Alliance^Leatherworking^Peter Galen^Peter Galen^^^^Bring 2 Tough Scorpid Breastplates
column2: 2 Tough Scorpid Gloves
column3: and 10 Worn Dragonscales to Peter Galen in Azshara.^Dragonscale leatherworking isn't easy
column4: but it's extremely rewarding. I'll teach you how to make this fine mail armor
column5: but only if you agree to certain conditions. By choosing this path
column6: you agree never to learn elemental or tribal leatherworking; there is only room for one of the three at the apex of the craft. Furthermore
column7: I'll need some samples of your best work involving scorpid armor. Finally
column8: I'll need proof of your ability to acquire the staple of the trade: scales of the dragonkin.

column1: Little Pamela^55^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Marlene Redpath^Pamela Redpath^Little Pamela^^Pamela's Doll^Find Pamela Redpath in Darrowshire.^So many of us died at the battle of Darrowshire. So many died... and worse. When the battle began I hid my niece Pamela
column2: and I do not know what happened to her. I am but a wandering spirit
column3: but my heart still longs to know Pamela's fate. Please
column4: good <class>. Will you go to Darrowshire and search for her? It is to the east
column5: beyond Gahrron's Withering.

column1: Tribal Leatherworking^55^Alliance^Leatherworking^Caryssia Moonhunter^Caryssia Moonhunter^^^^Bring a Wild Leather Vest and a Wild Leather Helmet to Caryssia Moonhunter in Feralas.^To learn tribal leatherworking demands an understanding of how primal nature truly is; I know that you have already mastered the art of making wild leather armor
column2: and I am willing to complete your training. Know this
column3: <class>: by choosing this path you agree never to learn dragonscale or elemental leatherworking; there is only room for practice of one of the three arts. Furthermore
column4: bring to me the finest samples of your wild leather armor. From there
column5: we will begin your mastery.

column2: 2 Globe of Water
column3: 2 Core of Earth

column7: <class>: by choosing this path you agree never to learn dragonscale or tribal leatherworking; there is only room for practice of one of the three arts. Furthermore
column8: I'll need adequate proof that you are in tune with the elements of nature; to that end
column9: bring me the purest essences of fire
column10: water
column11: earth
column12: and wind.

column1: Wanted - Arnak Grimtotem^29^Horde^Thousand Needles^Wanted Poster - Arnak Grimtotem^Cliffwatcher Longhorn^^^^Slay Arnak Grimtotem and bring proof of your deed to Cliffwatcher Longhorn in Freewind Post.^Wanted: Arnak Grimtotem Arnak the outcast is wanted for the heinous crimes of murder and kidnapping. Handsome rewards will be given to those brave enough to bring this criminal to justice. Arnak was last seen on the cliffs near the Darkcloud Pinnacle. Show the proof of your deed to Cliffwatcher Longhorn in Freewind Post in order to claim the reward.

Tribal Leatherworking^55^Horde^Leatherworking^Se'Jib^Se'Jib^^^^Bring a Wild Leather Vest and a Wild Leather Helmet to Se'Jib in Stranglethorn Vale.^To learn tribal leatherworking demands an understanding of how primal nature truly is; I know that you have already mastered the art of making wild leather armor

column1: Pamela's Doll^55^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Pamela Redpath^Pamela Redpath^Little Pamela^^Auntie Marlene
column2: Uncle Carlin^Find Pamela's doll.^My auntie Marlene told me to stay here in our house because my father had to go and fight. My father's the bravest man in the whole world! But I've been here for a long time
column3: and he hasn't come for me. Sometimes bad people come and whisper to me and I want my dad to make them go away
column4: but he's not here! And sometimes when it gets dark I want to play with my doll but I can't because I left it in town. Will you find my doll for me?

column1: Hypercapacitor Gizmo^30^Horde^Thousand Needles^Wizlo Bearingshiner^Wizlo Bearingshiner^^^^Slay the beast and bring back the Hypercapacitor Gizmo and Panther Cage Key to Wizlo Bearingshiner.^I am the only survivor from our caravan attack by the centaur! A rare yet mighty panther is guarding my best gizmo
column2: which is around his neck. Hah! Even the centaur tremble in the presence of this ferocious beast! Here is the key to the cage. They took everything there
column3: but left him alone. Slay this beast and bring back my hypercapacitor
column4: and I shall reward you. The wrecked caravan is just north of here.

column1: Auntie Marlene^56^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Pamela Redpath^Marlene Redpath^Auntie Marlene^Pamela's Doll^^Speak with Marlene
column2: south of the Ruins of Andorhal.^Oh
column3: I'm so lonely! Where is my family? Auntie Marlene told me to stay here
column4: but then she left and never came back! And my dad... have you seen him? Maybe Auntie Marlene knows where he is. She lives near Andorhal
column5: in a house to the south. I think it was on a hill... she said it was on a hill. Please
column6: <name>. You're my new friend! Will you talk to my Auntie for me?

column1: A Strange Historian^56^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Marlene Redpath^Chromie^Auntie Marlene^^^Bring Joseph's Wedding Ring to Chromie.^I wish Joseph could again be with his daughter
column2: but it cannot be so. His soul was twisted by the Scourge
column3: and he became a monster. Oh
column4: he is doomed! But perhaps we can change his fate. Search the graves outside for Joseph's monument. His body's not there
column5: for it was trampled and destroyed years ago
column6: but under the monument is his wedding ring. Take that ring to Chromie... a strange gnome with very strange powers. Chromie is staying in the ruined inn at the northwest corner of Andorhal.

column1: The Annals of Darrowshire^56^All^Western Plaguelands^Chromie^Chromie^Auntie Marlene^^Brother Carlin^Bring the Annals of Darrowshire to Chromie in Andorhal.^To save Joseph Redpath
column2: we must first discover his past. We can learn this in the Annals of Darrowshire
column3: a book held in the city hall of Andorhal. Bring me that book. We can then learn Joseph's fate
column4: and with luck... change it!

column1: Forces of Jaedenar^51^All^Felwood^Greta Mosshoof^Greta Mosshoof^Forces of Jaedenar^^^Enter Jaedenar and slay 4 Jaedenar Hounds
column2: 4 Jaedenar Guardsmen
column3: 6 Jaedenar Adepts
column4: and 6 Jaedenar Cultists before returning to Greta Mosshoof in Felwood.^If I am to trust you in this matter
column5: you will first have to prove yourself. I must know that you are an enemy of the Shadow Council--the ones responsible for many evils here and abroad. Travel deeper into Felwood. To the west you will see a path leading to Jaedenar. It is there that the Council plots with the Burning Legion. Enter the depths of one of the corrupted Barrow Dens they inhabit and slay their kind. Return to me after you've done this. Then I will know you truly seek to help us.

column1: Verifying the Corruption^54^All^Felwood^Taronn Redfeather^Taronn Redfeather^^^^Seek out and destroy 2 Entropic Beasts and 2 Entropic Horrors while exploring Shatter Scar Vale. After checking to see if the craters there are still filled with corrupt fel water
column2: return to Taronn Redfeather in Felwood.^To the north
column3: along the east of the road in what's called Shatter Scar Vale
column4: is an area where infernals were called down during the last great war--the craters still scar the land
column5: as do the infernals themselves. I am curious about two things. First
column6: are there still entropic elementals roaming the area? And second
column7: are the craters still filled with the corrupt
column8: fetid water that gathered there years ago? Will you help me and check
column9: <name>? Be careful though
column10: the infernals destroy anything in their path.

column1: Collection of the Corrupt Water^52^All^Felwood^Greta Mosshoof^Greta Mosshoof^Forces of Jaedenar^^^Take the Empty Canteen to the Moon Well in the center of Jaedenar and fill it before returning to Greta Mosshoof in Felwood.^Deep within Jaedenar lies Shadow Hold--the main fortress of their corruption and evil. The Shadow Council has protective spells surrounding their lair in the form of braziers. If I am to find out any more information about our enemy through scrying
column2: then those braziers must be extinguished. By doing so
column3: I should be able to spy on the Council and find out who leads them. If you can
column4: take this canteen and fill it at the Moon Well in the center of Jaedenar. Return to me afterwards.

column1: Seeking Spiritual Aid^52^All^Felwood^Greta Mosshoof^Islen Waterseer^Forces of Jaedenar^^Cleansed Water Returns to Felwood^Take the Corrupt Moon Well Water to Islen Waterseer in the Barrens.^Take the corrupt water to the Barrens
column2: <name>. South of Ratchet
column3: hidden along the shore
column4: is an old friend of mine
column5: a shaman named Islen Waterseer. She is a powerful shaman who will help us. Her relationship with the spirits of water has always been strong. Our task being a noble one should be enough to persuade her and the spirits of water to aid us in this task. You should find her at a small camp right along the water's edge. And
column6: <name>
column7: ignore the pirates... they are but a nuisance and no threat to you.

column1: Cleansed Water Returns to Felwood^54^All^Felwood^Islen Waterseer^Greta Mosshoof^Cleansed Water Returns to Felwood^Seeking Spiritual Aid^^Take the Purified Moon Well Water to Greta Mosshoof in Felwood.^Thank the spirits
column2: <name>. They are the ones that have come to your aid
column3: not me. I give this purified water to you now. Please give my regards to Greta and my best wishes. She is tackling something greater than many of us... as I'm sure she will soon find out. The Shadow Council is not a force to be trifled with
column4: <name>. Remember that. Go now. Take the water and return to Greta.

column1: The Matron Protectorate^60^All^Blackrock Spire^Awbee^Haleh^The Matron Protectorate^^^Travel to Winterspring and find Haleh. Give her Awbee's scale.^Travel to Kalimdor
column2: <race>. Our flight makes its home in the frigid landscape of Winterspring. Once you reach Winterspring
column3: find the caves of Mazthoril. Upon the icy floors of Mazthoril you will find cobalt runes. Hold one of my scales and stand upon a rune and you shall be transported to Haleh
column4: our matron protectorate. Give her the scale so that she may scry what it is I have seen and felt
column5: here in this doomed place.

column1: Wrath of the Blue Flight^60^All^Winterspring^Haleh^Haleh^The Matron Protectorate^^^Speak with Haleh if you wish to continue.^We understand what the cursed brood of Deathwing attempts to do and we know that it cannot be allowed. Because of the protection Blackrock mountain affords Nefarian
column2: it has become increasingly difficult for us to intercede. We can
column3: however
column4: empower you
column5: mortal - should you so choose. The path before you is one full of peril. You must decide whether to accept our help. Ponder this and speak with me again when a decision has been made.

column1: Wrath of the Blue Flight^60^All^Western Plaguelands^Haleh^Jeziba^The Matron Protectorate^^^Speak with Jeziba in the Plaguelands. He resides in Andorhal.^It is the arcane that I control and the arcane which will send you to your next destination. When you are ready
column2: the journey will begin. To the Plaguelands you will go and to Jeziba you will speak. He is a mortal as wise as the ancients and as patient as the immovable earth. Find him in Andorhal.

column1: Are We There
column2: Yeti?^58^All^Winterspring^Umi Rumplesnicker^Umi Rumplesnicker^Are We There
column3: Yeti?^^A Yeti of Your Own^Take Umi's Mechanical Yeti and scare her friends with it:^It's all ready
column4: <name>! Now
column5: I sent some mail to my friends already
column6: telling them that I have a surprise for them. This is where you come in! I'm going to give you my mechanical yeti
column7: and you need to surprise them by paying each of my friends a visit
column8: turning the yeti on and sending it towards them. Once you have shown Legacki in Everlook
column9: Sprinkle in Gadgetzan
column10: and Quixxil in Marshal's Refuge
column11: come back and tell me what happened! Please bring my yeti back to me then
column12: too.

column1: Catalogue of the Wayward^60^All^Western Plaguelands^Jeziba^Catalogue of the Wayward^The Matron Protectorate^^Breastplate of the Chromatic Flight
column2: Legplates of the Chromatic Defier^Read from the Catalogue of the Wayward.^A finer instrument of justice
column3: Haleh could not have chosen. Read from the catalogue of the wayward and be enlightened. Should you persist... should you do what is asked of you... should you survive... a hero you will make.

column1: Dousing the Flames of Protection^55^All^Felwood^Greta Mosshoof^Greta Mosshoof^Cleansed Water Returns to Felwood^^A Final Blow^Using the Purified Moon Well Water
column2: douse the flames of the four braziers of protection within Shadow Hold in Felwood
column3: then return to Greta Mosshoof in the Emerald Sanctuary.^Now
column4: you must return to Jaedenar. The braziers are more than likely spread throughout Shadow Hold. Douse each of their flames and the protections the Council has set up will fall for at least a short period of time. I will be waiting for that to happen. When it does
column5: I will look deep within the Hold and try to find out who the head of this beast is. Then
column6: and only then
column7: will we see about attacking them directly.

column1: Breastplate of the Chromatic Flight^60^All^Western Plaguelands^Catalogue of the Wayward^Jeziba^^Catalogue of the Wayward^^To forge the Breastplate of the Chromatic Flight
column2: you will be required to bring the following items to Jeziba the 'Sculptor':^The forging of a powerful breastplate to protect against the unrelenting attacks of the chromatic flight is one built upon irony. The scales of the very beasts we battle must be sewn to the pristine carapace of an elder chromatic drake or dragon. None are known to exist at this time and we should hope that none will ever exist. Lastly
column3: perhaps the most difficult of all components: the blood of heroes. The Sculptor must ultimately forge this creation.

column1: Legplates of the Chromatic Defier^60^All^Western Plaguelands^Catalogue of the Wayward^Jeziba^^Catalogue of the Wayward^^To forge the Legplates of the Chromatic Defier
column2: you will be required to bring the following items to Jeziba the 'Sculptor':^The carapace of a mature chromatic drake is needed to form the foundation of the leggings. Brilliant chromatic scales are then layered upon the wire frame and enchanted in the blood of heroes. Finally
column3: the supple skin of shadow must be applied to the inner greaves.

column1: Heroes of Darrowshire^56^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Carlin Redpath^Carlin Redpath^^Brother Carlin^Marauders of Darrowshire^Bring Davil's Libram and Redpath's Shield to Carlin Redpath.^The heroes of Darrowshire hold a place in my heart
column2: and the book you brought me
column3: the Annals of Darrowshire
column4: tells their tales. It tells of the paladin Davil Lightfire and how the Crusade took his libram to the town hall of Hearthglen. Its passages also speak of my brother
column5: Captain Redpath. After his betrayal
column6: his shield was cracked and discarded and now lies in the most unlikely of places -- near the barn of Gahrron's Withering. Gather these relics
column7: <name>. For fate and tragedy surrounds them.

column1: Villains of Darrowshire^57^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Carlin Redpath^Carlin Redpath^Brother Carlin^^Marauders of Darrowshire^Bring the Skull of Horgus and the Shattered Sword of Marduk to Carlin Redpath at Light's Hope Chapel.^The Annals of Darrowshire tells of the villains of that battle. It tells how the ghoul lord Horgus the Ravager was destroyed by Alliance forces during the battle. His body was cast into a lake
column2: northwest of Corin's Crossing
column3: and his skull remains there. Marduk the Black was never defeated
column4: but his fabled sword was shattered and lost. It lies at the bottom of the gorge west of Corin's Crossing. Retrieve these items
column5: <name>. I know not why
column6: but I am certain their fate lies with you.

column1: Winterfall Intrusion^60^Alliance^Winterspring^Rivern Frostwind^Rivern Frostwind^^^^Rivern Frostwind wants you to slay 5 Winterfall Shaman and 5 Winterfall Ursa.^My presence goes unnoticed by most
column2: <name>. However
column3: there is an annoyance that seems firmly rooted here in Winterspring: the Winterfall furbolg. Although I have never directly attacked the furbolg
column4: they seem crazed
column5: fearful of anything in their path. I have watched them slay countless creatures that had the misfortune to simply be in the wrong place at the wrong time. I am weary of their meddling -- please
column6: help me by fighting back. Slay the furbolg and keep them away from Frostsaber Rock.

column1: A Strange Red Key^55^All^Felwood^Blood Red Key^Captured Arko'narin^^^Rescue From Jaedenar^Search through Jaedenar to discover what the Blood Red Key is used for.^The small red key seems to be made of some kind of bone material. It is heavy in your hand
column2: but appears very fragile. Why would a member of the Shadow Council have such a thing? Perhaps there is something within Jaedenar that this strange key unlocks.

column1: Rescue From Jaedenar^55^All^Felwood^Captured Arko'narin^Jessir Moonbow^Rescue From Jaedenar^A Strange Red Key^^Escort Arko'narin to where Lightforge and her equipment are being held
column2: and then protect her as you escape Shadow Hold. Afterwards
column3: seek out Jessir Moonbow in Felwood to let her know what's happened to her friends.^But
column4: as much as it pains me
column5: there is one thing that must be done first: I have to find Trey's sword Lightforge and escape Shadow Hold to tell my superiors what's happening here. Can you help me
column6: <name>? Our equipment isn't far from here
column7: and you've already proven you can survive the path to the top. After we escape
column8: I'll head to Darnassus if you can find my friend Jessir near the Ashenvale border. She was to meet us at the Emerald Circle's camp near there. What do you say
column9: <name>? Can you help me again?

column1: Retribution of the Light^57^All^Felwood^Jessir Moonbow^Remains of Trey Lightforge^Rescue From Jaedenar^^^Return to Jaedenar and kill the succubus Rakaiah before finding the Remains of Trey Lightforge.^She would like to pretend that she's fine. She'd love for me to think that she's strong enough to deal with all of this on her own
column2: but I know better than that. Trey's death and hearing the torture he was put through is going to haunt her for a long time
column3: and there's nothing we can do to stop that. But we can give her some peace! <name>
column4: return to Shadow Hold
column5: kill Trey's torturer and find his remains. There is no reason we can't tie off all these loose ends while Arko'narin mourns in her own private way.

column1: Marauders of Darrowshire^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Carlin Redpath^Carlin Redpath^Marauders of Darrowshire^Heroes of Darrowshire
column2: Villains of Darrowshire^^Bring 5 Resonating Skulls and the Mystic Crystal to Carlin Redpath in Eastern Plaguelands.^Chromie said the relics you gathered are reagents to a powerful spell
column3: and one more is required: skulls from the scourge who took part in the battle of Darrowshire. Take this crystal and hunt scourge champions for their skulls. The crystal is enchanted; if a champion took part in the battle
column4: then when you pass the crystal over its skull it will resonate. Bring me those resonating skulls. Go
column5: <name>. You'll find scourge champions in the Noxious Glade to the north and the Fungal Vale to the west.

column1: Brother Carlin^56^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Chromie^Carlin Redpath^Brother Carlin^The Annals of Darrowshire^Heroes of Darrowshire^Bring the Extended Annals of Darrowshire to Carlin Redpath in Eastern Plaguelands.^The Annals of Darrowshire
column2: through my magic
column3: has gained pages at its end
column4: and now it extends its history beyond the battle. One of the extra passages tells of another Redpath
column5: Carlin
column6: who survived Joseph's betrayal. Carlin's now in the Plaguelands to the east
column7: at the Light's Hope Chapel. Take the book and speak with him.

column1: Defenders of Darrowshire^55^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Carlin Redpath^Carlin Redpath^Uncle Carlin^^^Free 15 Darrowshire Spirits and return to Carlin Redpath.^Many of the defenders fell at the battle of Darrowshire. And many roam again as the ghastly servants of the Scourge! Find these poor souls and end their misery! Hunt cannibal ghouls
column2: gibbering ghouls and diseased flayers. Many of these fiends were once the good folk of Darrowshire and destroying their forms now will set their souls free. You will find them in Plaguewood and Corin's Crossing
column3: and in other Scourge strongholds of Eastern Plaguelands.

column1: The Flesh Does Not Lie^60^All^Stratholme^Betina Bigglezink^Betina Bigglezink^The Flesh Does Not Lie^^^Recover 10 Plagued Flesh Samples from Stratholme and return them to Betina Bigglezink. You suspect that any creature in Stratholme would have said flesh sample.^The Forsaken apothecaries are not the only beings in this world schooled in the sciences. I have been studying the plague for years
column2: <race>. We had previously thought that the potency of the plague was dwindling
column3: but what I have discovered here in the Plaguelands is startling. The plague seems to be growing in strength! I need to run more tests! The most potent source of the plague is from the tainted flesh of the most recently infected. Travel to Stratholme and bring me samples
column4: <name>.

column1: The Active Agent^60^All^Stratholme^Betina Bigglezink^Betina Bigglezink^The Flesh Does Not Lie^^^Travel to Stratholme and search the ziggurats. Find and return new Scourge Data to Betina Bigglezink.^You will have to delve deeper into Stratholme
column2: <name>. Beyond the first gates you will find the ziggurats. We know that the Scourge draws great power from these structures. Search the Ziggurats and return with any information that you may discover.

column1: The Great Fras Siabi^60^All^Stratholme^Smokey LaRue^Smokey LaRue^^^^Find Fras Siabi's smoke shop in Stratholme and recover a box of Siabi's Premium Tobacco. Return to Smokey LaRue when the job is done.^Terrible thing... what happened to Fras. You see
column2: the town was sacked and Fras didn't want to leave his precious goods behind. The last thing I remember him saying was
column3: 'I'll burn every last leaf before they get their damned
column4: dirty hands on them!' I may love a good stogie but I'm no fool. I left Fras and his delightful store that day. I assume he went down in flames but if there's a chance that even one box of his famous tobacco is still intact... What do you say
column5: <name>? Find a box for ol' Smokey?

column1: The Scourge Cauldrons^53^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Commander Ashlam Valorfist^High Priestess MacDonnell^The Scourge Cauldrons^Clear the Way^^Speak with High Priestess MacDonnell at Chillwind Point
column2: Western Plaguelands.^Within the lands of former Lordaeron are eight cauldrons - four here in the west
column3: and four more ensconced in the east. These cauldrons spew poisons into the air
column4: propagating the plague throughout the land for the Scourge. The necromantic might of Kel'Thuzad is too strong to outright shut down these cauldrons
column5: but we think we might have a way to subvert them to our advantage. My second
column6: High Priestess MacDonnell
column7: will be your point on this assignment; she'll continue the briefing from here.

column1: Target: Felstone Field^53^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^High Priestess MacDonnell^Scourge Cauldron^The Scourge Cauldrons^^Felstone Field Cauldron^Go to Felstone Field in Western Plaguelands to locate and defeat the Cauldron Lord present there. It may have a key that will allow access to the cauldron. You must have the Empty Felstone Field Bottle with you to secure a sample of the poisons used inside the cauldron.^Of the four cauldrons here in the west
column2: the one located at Felstone Field may be the easiest one in obtaining access to. The Scourge have greener troops positioned here
column3: though they should not be underestimated. Go to Felstone Field
column4: northwest of Andorhal
column5: and engage the cauldron lord there. We think it has a key that will unlock access to the cauldron. When unlocked
column6: use this bottle to obtain a sample of the poisons inside the cauldron; we'll need it for study in developing a counter agent.

column1: Return to Chillwind Camp^53^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Scourge Cauldron^High Priestess MacDonnell^The Scourge Cauldrons^^^Bring the Filled Felstone Field Bottle to High Priestess MacDonnell at Chillwind Camp
column2: Western Plaguelands.^You fill the bottle with enough of the cauldron's poisonous concoction for a suitable sample to be studied. With the poison in hand
column3: it is time to return to High Priestess MacDonnell at Chillwind Camp to complete the mission.

column1: Target: Dalson's Tears^55^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^High Priestess MacDonnell^Scourge Cauldron^The Scourge Cauldrons^^Dalson's Tears Cauldron^Go to Dalson's Tears in Western Plaguelands to locate and defeat the Cauldron Lord present there
column2: and use its key to gain access to the cauldron. You must have the Empty Dalson's Tears Bottle with you to secure a sample of the poisons used inside the cauldron.^One of the plague cauldrons is located in the field of a former farmhouse now referred to as Dalson's Tears. Well
column3: we shall shed no tears this day as we thwart the Scourge and have them choke on their own fumes! Go to Dalson's Tears
column4: almost due north of Andorhal
column5: and eliminate the cauldron lord there. It should have a key like the last one did
column6: allowing you into the cauldron. Use this bottle to obtain a sample from inside the cauldron; each cauldron has its own distinct brew of toxins it uses.

column1: Return to Chillwind Camp^55^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Scourge Cauldron^High Priestess MacDonnell^The Scourge Cauldrons^^^Bring the Filled Dalson's Tears Bottle to High Priestess MacDonnell at Chillwind Camp
column2: Western Plaguelands.^You carefully fill the bottle with enough of the cauldron's ichors for what you consider to be suitably sized sample. With the poison in hand
column3: it is time to return to High Priestess MacDonnell at Chillwind Camp to complete the mission.

column1: Target: Writhing Haunt^55^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^High Priestess MacDonnell^Scourge Cauldron^The Scourge Cauldrons^^Writhing Haunt Cauldron^Go to the Writhing Haunt in Western Plaguelands to locate and defeat the Cauldron Lord present there
column2: and use its key to gain access to the cauldron. You must have the Empty Writhing Haunt Bottle with you to secure a sample of the poisons used inside the cauldron.^Two cauldrons have been successfully opened; while you will be able to access them indefinitely
column3: we still want to open up the other two that remain. This will provide all of us with more options to introduce the counter agent! This time
column4: you'll be hitting the Writhing Haunt's cauldron. It is almost due east of Andorhal
column5: relatively close to the ruined city walls; again
column6: eliminate the cauldron lord present there for its key. Use this bottle to obtain the sample from the cauldron. Good hunting
column7: <name>!

column1: Return to Chillwind Camp^55^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Scourge Cauldron^High Priestess MacDonnell^The Scourge Cauldrons^^^Bring the Filled Writhing Haunt Bottle to High Priestess MacDonnell at Chillwind Camp
column2: Western Plaguelands.^You delicately top off the empty bottle; a sample of the foul substance that churns under the platform of the cauldron now oozes back and forth inside the fragile glass container. With the poison in hand
column3: it is time to return to High Priestess MacDonnell at Chillwind Camp to complete the mission.

column1: Target: Gahrron's Withering^58^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^High Priestess MacDonnell^Scourge Cauldron^The Scourge Cauldrons^^Gahrron's Withering Cauldron^Go to Gahrron's Withering in Western Plaguelands to locate and defeat the Cauldron Lord present there
column2: and use its key to gain access to the cauldron. You must have the Empty Gahrron's Withering Bottle with you to secure a sample of the poisons used inside the cauldron.^The last cauldron that remains is located on a farm now called Gahrron's Withering. It is guarded by some of the Scourge's tougher minions - specifically
column3: wraiths and ghosts. They are not to be trifled with
column4: <name>. Gahrron's Withering is due northeast of our position here
column5: close to where the Eastern Plaguelands begin; again
column6: eliminate the cauldron lord present there for its key. Here is your empty sample bottle; bring it to me filled. May the Light protect you in this dangerous mission
column7: <class>.

column1: Return to Chillwind Camp^58^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Scourge Cauldron^High Priestess MacDonnell^The Scourge Cauldrons^^Mission Accomplished!^Bring the Filled Gahrron's Withering Bottle to High Priestess MacDonnell at Chillwind Camp
column2: Western Plaguelands.^You carefully close the spigot in the control panel
column3: watching the cauldron's putrid ichors drip into the empty bottle. With the poison in hand
column4: it is time to return to High Priestess MacDonnell at Chillwind Camp to complete the mission.

column1: The Scourge Cauldrons^53^Horde^Western Plaguelands^High Executor Derrington^Shadow Priestess Vandis^The Scourge Cauldrons^Scarlet Diversions^^Speak with Shadow Priestess Vandis at the Bulwark
column2: Western Plaguelands.^Within the lands of former Lordaeron are eight cauldrons - four in the west
column3: and four more entrenched in the east. These cauldrons spew poisons into the air
column4: propagating the plague throughout the land for the Scourge. The necromantic might of Kel'Thuzad is too strong to outright shut down these cauldrons
column5: but we think we might have a way to subvert them to our advantage. My second
column6: Shadow Priestess Vandis
column7: will be your point on this assignment; she'll continue the briefing from here.

column1: Target: Felstone Field^53^Horde^Western Plaguelands^Shadow Priestess Vandis^Scourge Cauldron^The Scourge Cauldrons^^Felstone Field Cauldron^Go to Felstone Field in Western Plaguelands to locate and defeat the Cauldron Lord present there. It may have a key that will allow access to the cauldron. You must have the Empty Felstone Field Bottle with you to secure a sample of the poisons used inside the cauldron.^Of the four cauldrons in the Western Plaguelands
column2: the one at Felstone Field may be the easiest one to gain access to. The Scourge have greener troops positioned here
column3: though they should not be underestimated. Go to Felstone Field
column4: due east of here and northwest of Andorhal
column5: and engage the cauldron lord there. On it is a key that will unlock access to the cauldron. When unlocked
column6: use this bottle to get a sample of the cauldron's toxins; we'll need it for study in developing a counter agent.

column1: Return to the Bulwark^53^Horde^Western Plaguelands^Scourge Cauldron^Shadow Priestess Vandis^The Scourge Cauldrons^^^Bring the Filled Felstone Field Bottle to Shadow Priestess Vandis at the Bulwark
column2: Western Plaguelands.^You fill the bottle with enough of the cauldron's poisonous concoction for a suitable sample to be studied. With the poison in hand

column2: and use its key to gain access to the cauldron. You must have the Empty Dalson's Tears Bottle with you to secure a sample of the poisons used inside the cauldron.^One of the plague cauldrons is located in the field of a former farmhouse now referred to as Dalson's Tears. No tears will be shed this day
column3: <class>; we must strike at this cauldron and gain access to it! Go to Dalson's Tears
column4: almost due north of Andorhal
column5: and eliminate the cauldron lord there. It should have a key like the last one did
column6: allowing you inside the cauldron's innards. Use this bottle to obtain a sample from inside the cauldron; each cauldron has its own distinct brew of toxins it uses.

column2: Western Plaguelands.^You carefully fill the bottle with enough of the cauldron's ichors for what you consider to be suitably sized sample. With the poison in hand

column2: and use its key to gain access to the cauldron. You must have the Empty Writhing Haunt Bottle with you to secure a sample of the poisons used inside the cauldron.^Two cauldrons have been successfully opened; while you'll be able to access them indefinitely

column5: relatively close to the ruined city walls; again
column6: eliminate the cauldron lord present there for its key. Use this bottle to obtain the sample from the cauldron. Good hunting
column7: <name>!

column1: Return to the Bulwark^55^Horde^Western Plaguelands^Scourge Cauldron^Shadow Priestess Vandis^The Scourge Cauldrons^^^Bring the Filled Writhing Haunt Bottle to Shadow Priestess Vandis at The Bulwark

You must have the Empty Gahrron's Withering Bottle with you to secure a sample of the poisons used inside the cauldron.^The last cauldron that remains is located on a farm now called Gahrron's Withering. It is guarded by some of the Scourge's tougher minions - specifically
column3: wraiths and ghosts. They are not to be trifled with
column4: <name>. Gahrron's Withering is far to the east of the Bulwark

column1: Uncle Carlin^56^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Pamela Redpath^Carlin Redpath^Uncle Carlin^Pamela's Doll^^Find Carlin Redpath.^Sometimes
column2: when it's nighttime
column3: I can hear my Uncle Carlin crying. It sounds like he's far away
column4: to the east. I hope he's not crying for me! <name>
column5: will you find my uncle and tell him I'm alright? If you find him say I'm waiting for him
column6: and I want to hear the story he used to tell... the one about the rabbits and the berry jam! That story's so funny!

column1: A Final Blow^58^All^Felwood^Greta Mosshoof^Greta Mosshoof^^Dousing the Flames of Protection^^Kill Moora and Salia
column2: and bring Shadow Lord Fel'dan's Head to Greta Mosshoof in Felwood.^Unfortunately
column3: I see the only way to stop this threat to Felwood is a frontal attack. There are no other ways into Shadow Hold
column4: and I have no means to teleport you inside. The straight path down to the bottom is the only way... and I also know who you should seek out. His name is Fel'dan... Shadow Lord Fel'dan. He is the mortal in power down below... he is the head of the serpent. Kill him and his two succubus servants and return to me. Fel'dan is the one making pacts with the Legion. He must be stopped.

column1: Houses of the Holy^60^All^Stratholme^Leonid Barthalomew the Revered^Leonid Barthalomew the Revered^^^^Travel to Stratholme
column2: in the north. Search the supply crates that litter the city and recover 5 Stratholme Holy Water. Return to Leonid Barthalomew the Revered when you have collected enough of the blessed fluid.^I look at my undeath as a malady
column3: <race>. An illness that merely requires treatment; however
column4: it is also a great blessing for the Argent Dawn. What better vessel to smite the heathens of the Scourge than through the undead? I am revered by my colleagues because of the sacrifices I have made
column5: but the accolades mean nothing to me. If you are interested in assisting the Argent Dawn
column6: then a job I can offer. Venture to Stratholme and recover our surplus of holy water. Search the supply crates.

column1: The Ruins of Kel'Theril^56^Alliance^Winterspring^Wynd Nightchaser^Jaron Stoneshaper^To Winterspring!^^^Speak with Jaron Stoneshaper in Starfall Village.^The story behind Kel'Theril is one of a cursed race
column2: bound to the place where they attempted an unfortunate ritual... The highborne that you will find there once stole a sacred artifact
column3: believing that they could siphon its power for themselves
column4: becoming even more powerful. In their efforts
column5: the relic shattered in a huge explosion
column6: driving the pieces below the ice of the lake... Speak with Jaron Stoneshaper if you'd like to learn more; he has recently visited the area and can tell you more.

column1: Troubled Spirits of Kel'Theril^56^Alliance^Winterspring^Jaron Stoneshaper^Aurora Skycaller^To Winterspring!^^^Use Jaron's Pick to find the four Highborne Relic Fragments. Bring them to Aurora Skycaller in Eastern Plaguelands.^The highborne spirits are miserable creatures
column2: that's for sure. They are still searching for pieces of the very thing that has cursed them to Kel'Theril forever -- the stolen relic. If you are that interested
column3: take my pick and go south to the lake
column4: see if you can gather the pieces of it from within the ice. Now
column5: I can't tell you a thing about what you find
column6: but I do know of someone who might... Aurora Skycaller; she dwells near the Northpass Tower in the northern part of Eastern Plaguelands.

column1: Fragments of the Past^56^Alliance^Eastern Plaguelands^Aurora Skycaller^Aurora Skycaller^To Winterspring!^^^Find the Sacred Highborne Writings in the Temple of Zin-Malor in Azshara
column2: and bring them to Aurora Skycaller near the Northpass Tower in Eastern Plaguelands.^I did not realize... Forgive my callous words
column3: <class>. The mistakes of my ancestors are not what I wish to dwell on
column4: but if your request is truly genuine
column5: then I will help you. <Aurora examines the fragments.> I believe this is the Crystal of Zin-Malor
column6: an artifact that can contain and control strong arcane forces. It could have been used for good
column7: but the evil intentions of those that stole it caused it to shatter. Go to the Temple of Zin-Malor in Azshara - I can only hope the book is still there.

column1: Fragments of the Past^57^Alliance^Eastern Plaguelands^Aurora Skycaller^Aurora Skycaller^To Winterspring!^^Tormented By the Past^Bring an Enchanted Thorium Bar
column2: 5 Crystal Restore
column3: and a Vial of Dire Water to Aurora Skycaller near the Northpass Tower in Eastern Plaguelands.^I will be able to help you
column4: if recreating the artifact is truly what you wish to do. To seal the pieces back together
column5: I will need items with strong magical qualities. An enchanted thorium bar and five crystal restore... You'll also need to collect some water from what might seem an unlikely place... Find the dire pool along Eldreth Row at Dire Maul in Feralas
column6: and fill this vial. While you are gone
column7: I will attempt to glean from these pages the knowledge I need to repair the damage done to the relic.

column1: Tormented By the Past^58^Alliance^Eastern Plaguelands^Aurora Skycaller^Remorseful Highborne^Tormented By the Past^Fragments of the Past^^Take the Crystal of Zin-Malor to Lake Kel'Theril in Winterspring and find a highborne spirit that will speak to you.^<name>
column2: I weep for what has happened in the past. Like this crystal
column3: the elves
column4: as a race
column5: have been shattered. I do not know if the pieces will ever again be reunited into one
column6: but my sorrow has been eased by being able to help you with this one small task. We must not forget the past
column7: <name>... Please take the Crystal of Zin-Malor back to Lake Kel'Theril. You must find a highborne spirit that realizes the error of what was done so long ago. Show the spirit that we have made things right again.

column1: To Winterspring!^56^Alliance^Felwood^Ivy Leafrunner^Wynd Nightchaser^To Winterspring!^^^Find Starfall Village in Winterspring and speak with Wynd Nightchaser.^In Winterspring
column2: to the north of here
column3: there are many ancient elven ruins. It's a harsh land
column4: but it holds many secrets and places to explore. With all my work to do here in Felwood
column5: I have not had the opportunity to travel to Winterspring. But there's no reason why you shouldn't! While you're there
column6: look for Wynd Nightchaser. He spends most of his time in Starfall Village and he knows a lot about the area.

column1: Starfall^56^Alliance^Winterspring^Daryn Lightwind^Wynd Nightchaser^Starfall^^^Find Starfall in Winterspring and speak with Wynd Nightchaser.^In Winterspring
column2: to the north of Felwood
column3: there are many ancient elven ruins. It's a harsh land
column4: but it holds many secrets and places to explore. My studies here keep me so busy that I have not had the opportunity to travel to Winterspring for some time. But there's no reason why you shouldn't travel there and study the ruins. While you're there
column5: look for Wynd Nightchaser. He spends most of his time in Starfall and he knows a lot about the area. Tell him that you are a student of mine...

column1: The Archivist^60^All^Stratholme^Duke Nicholas Zverenhoff^Duke Nicholas Zverenhoff^^^The Truth Comes Crashing Down^Travel to Stratholme and find Archivist Galford of the Scarlet Crusade. Destroy him and burn down the Scarlet Archive.^Anything taken to an extreme is hazardous to our world
column2: <name>. Take for example
column3: the Scarlet Crusade. Do you believe that their blind zealotry serves a greater good? How many innocents have they destroyed in the name of the Light? Blasphemers
column4: one and all! One in particular interests me
column5: though; the Archivist Galford of Stratholme: A man that watches over the Crusade's most valued documents. Destroy him and burn down his archives! Should you succeed
column6: return to me and be rewarded.

column1: Remorseful Highborne^58^Alliance^Winterspring^Remorseful Highborne^Wynd Nightchaser^Tormented By the Past^^^Speak with Wynd Nightchaser in Starfall Village
column2: and ask about the proper place for the Crystal of Zin-Malor.^The... the crystal... The highborne here are clouded by their own misssery... I am sorrrrrowful
column3: but I realize the errorrrr of what happened so long ago. Even though there is no waaaay to change the past
column4: I am now at peacccce knowing that you have recovered the crystal of Zin-Malor... Youuu must return it... It muuuussst be returrrned.

column1: The Crystal of Zin-Malor^58^Alliance^Winterspring^Wynd Nightchaser^Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm^Tormented By the Past^^^Deliver the Crystal of Zin-Malor to Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm in Darnassus.^Quite impressive
column2: <name>. The crystal of Zin-Malor can never be returned to the temple which
column3: as you know
column4: lies in ruin. But I believe that your effort to undo the evil of the past should not go unrewarded. Seek out Arch Druid Fandral Staghelm in Darnassus
column5: and bring the crystal to him
column6: <name>. It should be in the hands of those that will not abuse its power. From the looks of it
column7: only a handful of the strongest magic users would be able to control such a power.

column1: Eagan Peltskinner^2^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Deputy Willem^Eagan Peltskinner^Eagan Peltskinner^A Threat Within^^Speak with Eagan Peltskinner.^Eagan Peltskinner is looking for someone to hunt diseased wolves for him. That's good news
column2: because we're seeing a lot more diseased wolves in Northshire Valley lately. If you're interested then speak with Eagan. He's around the side of the abbey
column3: to the left.

column1: The Truth Comes Crashing Down^60^All^Stratholme^Head of Balnazzar^Duke Nicholas Zverenhoff^The Truth Comes Crashing Down^The Archivist^^Take the Head of Balnazzar to Duke Nicholas Zverenhoff in the Eastern Plaguelands.^You try and gather your thoughts as the dust settles across the chamber. You go over the events that just transpired and still cannot comprehend the gravity of the situation. The Grand Crusader of the Scarlet Crusade a demon? And not just any demon but brother to Varimathras
column2: arch lord of the Undercity? You carefully stow the severed head of the dreadlord into your pack. Surely
column3: none would believe the tale you would tell without proof. Duke Nicholas Zverenhoff must be told at once!

column1: Above and Beyond^60^All^Stratholme^Duke Nicholas Zverenhoff^Duke Nicholas Zverenhoff^The Truth Comes Crashing Down^^Lord Maxwell Tyrosus^Venture to Stratholme and destroy Baron Rivendare. Take his head and return to Duke Nicholas Zverenhoff.^You display a natural aptitude for destruction and you follow orders. It is rare to see the two coexist. I am beginning to think that you may make an excellent vehicle of divine justice. <Zverenhoff clasps his hands together in front of his face.> Kel'Thuzad's errand boy rules over Stratholme. Prove to me that you are a champion - my champion. Destroy Baron Rivendare and return to me with his head.

Lord Maxwell Tyrosus^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Duke Nicholas Zverenhoff^Lord Maxwell Tyrosus^Lord Maxwell Tyrosus^Above and Beyond^^Speak with Lord Maxwell Tyrosus. He is inside the church.^I am about to bestow a great honor upon you
column2: <name>. Lord Maxwell wishes to reward you for your service to the Argent Dawn! It has been years since Maxwell has granted audience to outsiders.

column1: The Argent Hold^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Lord Maxwell Tyrosus^The Argent Hold^Lord Maxwell Tyrosus^^^Open the Argent Hold and claim your reward.^Through the years the Argent Hold has remained locked. None have been worthy to reach inside and take from it the power of the Argent Dawn - until today. The Argent Hold is now open to you
column2: <name>.

column1: The Restless Souls^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Caretaker Alen^Egan^The Restless Souls^^^Find Egan. You only know that he was last seen around Stratholme.^There are those that died tragically in the fall of Stratholme. Many took their own lives
column2: opting to hurl themselves into the myriad flames of the smoldering city rather than become one of the Scourge. They now walk the streets of Stratholme as restless spirits. We must aid them
column3: <name>! I have an associate named Egan who has been doing miraculous work with ghosts and souls. Seek him out. He walks the eastern Plaguelands
column4: near Stratholme
column5: testing his innovations.

column1: The Restless Souls^60^All^Stratholme^Egan^Egan^The Restless Souls^^^Use Egan's Blaster on the ghostly and spectral citizens of Stratholme. When the restless souls break free from their ghostly shells
column2: use the blaster again - freedom will be theirs!^I draw my power - my will to continue living and breathing - from the unmitigated hatred I have for the Scourge and all that they have done. I am
column3: however
column4: no zealot. There are those
column5: like the Scarlet Crusade
column6: who would sooner destroy the innocent undead than lend them even an ounce of compassion. Which brings me to this: My blaster. It will unchain the tortured souls from Stratholme. Use it on the ghosts that haunt the ransacked streets. Free their souls.

column1: The Art of the Armorsmith^40^Alliance^Blacksmithing^Grumnus Steelshaper^Grumnus Steelshaper^^^^To become an Armorsmith

column3: 2 Ornate Mithril Boots
column4: 1 Ornate Mithril Breastplate.^So ye made the smart decision. There ain't no love lost betwixt me an old Ironus here. That good for nothing toy maker knows who the true craftsmen round here be. The truly great wars are won with a good defense. When it be go time
column5: no offense is gonna be helping ye out. Right
column6: so let's get to work. All ye need to do is show me that ye've got some raw talent. After that
column7: I'll yank whatever impurities be left in ye and mold ye into an armorsmith. Ye do know how to make ornate mithril
column8: don't ye?

column3: 4 Massive Iron Axes

column5: and 2 Big Black Maces.^As a weaponsmith you'll find that more often than not

column7: the riches more than make up for the back strain and ash lung. Oh yes
column8: <name>
column9: weaponsmiths are the ones with all the gold! If you wish to join our ranks
column10: you'll need to show me that you can make me a silver or two - I mean
column11: show me that you've got what it takes to be the go to <guy/girl> when people need superior quality weapons. Get to work!

column1: The Art of the Armorsmith^40^Horde^Blacksmithing^Okothos Ironrager^Okothos Ironrager^^^^To become an armorsmith
column2: you must make the following items and return them to Okothos: 4 Ornate Mithril Helms
column3: 2 Ornate Mithril Boots
column4: 1 Ornate Mithril Breastplate.^Satisfaction. It is what I draw from the hammer and the anvil. To see a proud Horde warrior protected under my steel reminds me of what it is to be alive. It is an addiction that I dare never give up
column5: <name>. I can not grant you this satisfaction
column6: merely set you upon the path. As with all of life's endeavors
column7: the path of the armorsmith is a journey. If you wish to be one of the select few
column8: you need only to ask and I shall train
column9: but
column10: a task you must first complete.

column1: The Way of the Weaponsmith^40^Horde^Blacksmithing^Borgosh Corebender^Borgosh Corebender^^^^To become a Weaponsmith
column2: you must make the following items and return them to Borgosh: 4 Moonsteel Broadswords
column3: 4 Massive Iron Axes
column4: 2 Heavy Mithril Axes
column5: and 2 Big Black Maces.^One day
column6: I will create a legendary hammer. A hammer fit for a Warchief! It is my life's work
column7: <name>. My passion. I recognize that you have the potential to be among us
column8: one of us - a weaponsmith. I am the one that can help you harness that potential. A simple task is all that you must complete. Simple for one of your exceptional skill.

column1: Sweet Serenity^60^All^Blacksmithing^Lilith the Lithe^Lilith the Lithe^^^^Travel to Stratholme and kill the Crimson Hammersmith. Defeat him and bring me his apron. For that

column1: Snakestone of the Shadow Huntress^60^All^Blacksmithing^Kilram^Kilram^^^^Travel to Blackrock Spire and slay Shadow Hunter Vosh'gajin. Recover Vosh'gajin's Snakestone and return to Kilram.^Don't let her beauty fool you
column2: <class>. The shadow huntress
column3: Vosh'gajin is deadly and deranged. <Kilram points to the scar on his face.> Aye
column4: she gave me that - a love tap
column5: she called it. The time for vengeance has finally come. You can find Vosh'gajin in Blackrock Spire. Slay her and return to me with her snakestone. Do this and I will teach you the secret to crafting Dawn's Edge!

column1: Corruption^60^All^Blacksmithing^Seril Scourgebane^Seril Scourgebane^^^^Find the Black Guard Swordsmith in Stratholme and destroy him. Recover the Insignia of the Black Guard and return to Seril Scourgebane.^If I am short with you

column3: Corruption
column4: have been stolen by the Black Guard: Elite skeletal units of Baron Rivendare. Yes
column5: Baron Rivendare of Stratholme. The Black Guard swordsmith now guards those plans with his... undeath. Slay him and return proof of this deed and I shall grant you the knowledge required to create a blazing rapier!

column1: The Sleeper Has Awakened^20^All^Darkshore^Kerlonian Evershade^Liladris Moonriver^^^^Escort Kerlonian Evershade to Liladris Moonriver at Maestra's Post in Ashenvale.^I was on my way to Maestra's Post to meet Liladris Moonriver

column3: I have been so sleepy...  Would you mind showing me the way? I understand that Maestra's Post is south of here
column4: along the road in Ashenvale. It can be dangerous
column5: so I hope you have some friends that will join us. Lastly
column6: I may fall asleep so if you ever need to wake me
column7: please use my horn. You'll find it in the chest here.

column1: Barov Family Fortune^60^Horde^Scholomance^Alexi Barov^Alexi Barov^Barov Family Fortune^^^Venture to the Scholomance and recover the Barov family fortune. column4: Weldon
column5: is the other. Weldon
column6: the miserable coward
column7: fled during the war and thus retained his worthless existence as a human. He now searches for the deeds so that he may claim the fortune for his own. Recover the deeds before my brother does and I shall make you wealthy beyond your wildest dreams!

column1: The Last Barov^60^All^Western Plaguelands^Alexi Barov^Alexi Barov^Barov Family Fortune^^^Travel to Chillwind Camp - Alliance territory - and assassinate Weldon Barov. Take his head and return to Alexi Barov.^Naturally
column2: with my brother still alive
column3: there may be some contention as to the primary beneficiary of the family's fortune. This cannot be. A low down guttersnipe like you isn't above a little cold-blooded murder
column4: I hope. It's a simple task and one that I expect you will complete; that is
column5: if you wish to claim your reward. Weldon sits under Alliance protection at Chillwind Camp
column6: to the east. Slay him
column7: return his head. <Alexi yawns.> Hurry along now.

column1: Barov Family Fortune^60^Alliance^Scholomance^Weldon Barov^Weldon Barov^Barov Family Fortune^^^Venture to the Scholomance and recover the Barov family fortune. column1: The Last Barov^60^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Weldon Barov^Weldon Barov^Barov Family Fortune^^^Travel to the Bulwark - Horde territory - and assassinate Alexi Barov. Take his head and return to Weldon Barov.^With the deeds recovered

column3: I need not ever worry about an unscrupulous gang of mercenaries seeking my head. It's a simple task. Alexi hides under the protection of the Horde - at the Bulwark. No
column4: I do not expect you to just walk up and kill him
column5: I want his head! How you get it... well
column6: that part is up to you. That type of behavior is below one of my noble upbringing.

column4: Bloodbelly fish. The road south of here will take you west to the troll village.

column1: Lazy Peons^4^All^Durotar^Foreman Thazz'ril^Foreman Thazz'ril^^^Thazz'ril's Pick^Use the Foreman's Blackjack on Lazy Peons when they're sleeping. Wake up 5 peons

column4: you take this blackjack and use it on any lazy peons you find sleeping on the job. A good smack will get them right back to work! Return the blackjack when you're done. Lousy slacking peons...

column6: Ras Frostwhisper the lich
