column5: and no one knows my master unless he allows it. Leonid says Vectus wants the dragon eggs. He wants you to deliver them to him at the Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands. That hurts! Why you? Doesn't Vectus trust me? Oh
column6: never mind... just take the eggs and tell Leonid that I did what our master commanded.

column1: Chromatic Mantle of the Dawn^60^All^Western Plaguelands^Argent Quartermaster Hasana^Argent Quartermaster Hasana^^^^Bring 25 Argent Dawn Valor Tokens to Quartermaster Hasana at the Bulwark
column2: Western Plaguelands.^<Brother /Sister> <name> - your deeds on behalf of the Argent Dawn are far too numerous to be recounted easily. As a fitting tribute
column3: I'll part with one of our special Chromatic Mantles of the Dawn - a version that protects the wearer from all forms of resistible magic simultaneously. Chromatic Mantles of the Dawn are reserved for only the mightiest of the Dawn's heroes! Bring to me twenty-five valor tokens as a sign of tribute
column4: and I'll give you the finest of all our mantles.

column1: Shards of the Felvine^60^All^Moonglade^Rabine Saturna^Rabine Saturna^A Reliquary of Purity^^^Find the Felvine in Dire Maul and acquire a shard from it. Chances are you'll only be able to procure one with the demise of Alzzin the Wildshaper. Use the Reliquary of Purity to securely seal the shard inside
column2: and return it to Rabine Saturna in Nighthaven
column3: Moonglade.^Your knowledge of Eldre'Thalas - Dire Maul - in Feralas will now come into play
column4: <name>. In the eastern part of the ruined city is where Alzzin the Wildshaper has exerted his corrupt dominion. Go there with all due haste and brave whatever challenges await you. The Fruit of Fertility
column5: now corrupted as the Felvine
column6: should be close to Alzzin. When he falls
column7: capture whatever essence of the Felvine you can. Seal it in the Reliquary
column8: and bring it to me. Good luck
column9: and Cenarion's speed.

column1: A Reliquary of Purity^60^All^Moonglade^Rabine Saturna^Rabine Saturna^A Reliquary of Purity^^^Travel to Silithus and search for a Reliquary of Purity within the ruins of Southwind Village. If you are able to find it
column2: return with it to Rabine Saturna in Nighthaven
column3: Moonglade.^The first step is to find a container capable of holding an extremely corruptible substance without the handler suffering ill effects. There is only one sort device I am aware of that could possibly contain something as vile as the Felvine: a Reliquary of Purity. Deep in the wasteland of Silithus is the remnants of the night elf village known as Southwind. I know one was there many
column4: many years ago. If we are to succeed
column5: I need you to scour those ruins in the hopes of reclaiming it.

column1: Plagued Hatchlings^58^All^Scholomance^Betina Bigglezink^Betina Bigglezink^^^Healthy Dragon Scale^Kill 20 Plagued Hatchlings
column2: then return to Betina Bigglezink at the Light's Hope Chapel.^The Argent Dawn recently learned that the Scourge are creating their own plagued dragonflight! We must stop them -- if the Scourge gain a force of dragons they'll sweep across Azeroth unchecked! Their necromancers are breeding plagued dragons at the Scholomance
column3: in the middle of Darrowmere Lake. Go to the Scholomance and kill as many hatchlings as you can... before they get any bigger!

column1: Betina Bigglezink^60^All^Scholomance^Leonid Barthalomew the Revered^Betina Bigglezink^Leonid Barthalomew^^^Bring the Frozen Eggs to Betina Bigglezink.^The eggs you brought were to be used in Scourge experiments to create a plagued dragonflight. These frozen black dragon eggs would have been invaluable in their studies
column2: and would have assuredly quickened their timetable. Now
column3: it is time we ended their research. Take the frozen eggs to Betina Bigglezink outside. She is well-learned in science and alchemy
column4: and has produced a weapon we can use against the Scourge. With your help
column5: we will deal them a heavy blow.

column1: Scholomance^55^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Commander Ashlam Valorfist^Alchemist Arbington^Scholomance^All Along the Watchtowers^^Speak with Alchemist Arbington at Chillwind Point
column2: Western Plaguelands.^On the island of Caer Darrow lies Scholomance - a wretched center of Scourge necromancy and evil. Our enemy dwells within
column3: conducting unspeakable acts of depravity on unwitting victims... at least
column4: we surmise as much. A door bars the way
column5: and try as we might no entry is to be had without a proper key. Alchemist Arbington is well versed on Scholomance
column6: and has an idea how to obtain a key. You have proved your worth to me
column7: and now I entrust this task to you. Speak with him on this matter.

column1: Kim'jael's "Missing" Equipment^53^All^Azshara^Kim'jael^Kim'jael^^Kim'jael Indeed!^^Find Some Rune that the naga have in their possession in the Ruins of Eldarath and return it to Kim'jael in Azshara.^What?! What?! That wasn't good enough for you? You know how expensive those explosives are? They sell for... oh
column2: nevermind. Fine
column3: you want to make some real money? Cause that's how business is done: you prove you're a valuable employee and then you're rewarded adequately after you stick it out some. If you're a "valuable" employee
column4: then hit the Ruins of Eldarath and find me some rune that them Blood elves were lookin' for. The naga apparently have it in their possession.

column1: Spiritual Unrest^47^All^Azshara^Loh'atu^Loh'atu^^^^Destroy 6 Highborne Apparitions and 6 Highborne Lichlings before returning to Loh'atu in Azshara.^Long ago
column2: the Highborne were some of the most powerful students of the arcane the night elves ever produced. The corruption that comes along with such studies caused much harm to night elf society and greatly affected all of Azeroth... as I'm sure you well know. I promised the Sentinels that I would release the spirits from their mortal bonds as I find them. If you would do the same
column3: then I am sure I can reward you some. The spirits haunt the Shadowsong Shrine to the northeast of here.

column1: A Land Filled with Hatred^47^All^Azshara^Loh'atu^Loh'atu^^^^Kill 6 Haldarr Satyr
column2: 2 Haldarr Tricksters
column3: 2 Haldarr Felsworn and then return to Loh'atu on the border of Ashenvale.^The satyr
column4: a disfigured
column5: evil aspect of the night elves
column6: now infect the sacred lands once traveled by Cenarius. I cannot speak for the night elves when it comes to all the atrocities those demonic creatures have committed
column7: but I have sworn an oath to the Earthmother to aid the elves in ridding the land of such a nuisance. I am sure you would prove yourself if you aided me in purging them. Northeast of here
column8: you can find the Haldarr clan. Return to me after you've tested yourself against their power.

column1: Skeletal Fragments^57^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Alchemist Arbington^Alchemist Arbington^Scholomance^^^Bring 15 Skeletal Fragments to Alchemist Arbington at Chillwind Point
column2: Western Plaguelands.^The key to Scholomance is called a Skeleton Key. It must be forged from the remains of a skeleton - several actually - and hardened by only the strongest of metals within a suitable mold. A signet of power from a being who naturally can open the portal to Scholomance will make the key ultimately function. First thing's first though
column3: <name>. We'll need skeletal fragments for the key's forging. Skeletons inside Andorhal should yield what we need
column4: but the ones outside the walls might work too.

column1: Mold Rhymes With...^57^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Alchemist Arbington^Krinkle Goodsteel^Scholomance^^^Bring the Imbued Skeletal Fragments and 15 gold coins to Krinkle Goodsteel in Gadgetzan.^The goblin you will need to speak with is Krinkle Goodsteel. He peddles his skills to the highest bidder in Gadgetzan
column2: within the Tanaris desert. He'll likely be the only one who can produce the mold we need
column3: and his services won't come cheap. We now ask for you to dig deep by footing whatever fee he will charge. I'm an alchemist
column4: not a banker. If I had gold lying around
column5: I certainly wouldn't be here. I guess I said the quiet part out loud again. Oops. Gadgetzan awaits you! Good luck!

column1: Ammo for Rumbleshot^6^Alliance^Dun Morogh^Loslor Rudge^Hegnar Rumbleshot^^^^Bring Rumbleshot's Ammo to Hegnar Rumbleshot in Dun Morogh.^Hegnar Rumbleshot sells guns off the road to Anvilmar. Riflemen and mortar teams spend a lot of time practicing out near his shop
column2: and he's always needing fresh ammunition. But... the last crate of ammo I sent him got lost along the way. My courier said he was camped near the Grizzled Den when wendigo chased him away... and the fool left Rumbleshot's ammo behind! <name>
column3: can you get that ammo and take it to Rumbleshot? He's been waiting on it and I'm sure he's running low.

column1: Demon Dogs^56^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Tirion Fordring^Tirion Fordring^^^Redemption^Slay 20 Plaguehound Runts
column2: 5 Plaguehounds and 5 Frenzied Plaguehounds. Return to Tirion Fordring when the task is complete.^If you are going to remain here
column3: I ask only that you earn your keep. We have many nuisances that could use some 'discipline.' You can start with the Plaguehounds and their runts. I cannot offer much in return
column4: but you are guaranteed a warm meal and some conversation should you succeed.

column1: Blood Tinged Skies^56^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Tirion Fordring^Tirion Fordring^^^^Slay 30 Plaguebats and return to Tirion Fordring.^Woe to those that foolishly wander into the Plaguelands. All manner of foulness inhabit these woods - from the fanatical Scarlet Crusade
column2: who will kill any that do not bear the mark of the Crusade
column3: to the murderous Scourge
column4: who only look to bolster their numbers by adding more undead to their ranks. Even the wildlife have been transformed into rapacious
column5: man eating beasts. I ask that you destroy those that would strike from the skies: The Plaguebats.

column1: Carrion Grubbage^56^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Tirion Fordring^Tirion Fordring^^^^Seek out the Carrion Grubs and Devourers of the region. Slay them and harvest their meat. Return to Tirion Fordring when you have gathered 15 Slabs of Carrion Worm Meat.^My food supplies are running low
column2: <race>. I am ashamed to admit that I might not have enough food to share with you. Could you assist an old man with a simple task? Around here
column3: the only manner of beast unaffected by the ravages of the Plague are the Carrion worms. While rather bland in taste
column4: the meat of the worms can easily be preserved to last for months. I will need several hundred pounds to restock for the coming winter!

column1: A Bundle of Trouble^9^Alliance^Elwynn Forest^Supervisor Raelen^Supervisor Raelen^^^^Bring 8 Bundles of Wood to Raelen at the Eastvale Logging Camp.^I've got a real problem on my hands. I have a deadline looming for an order of lumber
column2: and I'm running out of time. The wolves and bears north of here have chased my workers away from the bundles of wood that they've already chopped. I've already talked to Deputy Rainer about clearing the animals
column3: but I need someone to go collect the wood for me. If you could collect eight bundles of wood for me I might just make my deadline.

column1: Kodo Roundup^34^All^Desolace^Smeed Scrabblescrew^Smeed Scrabblescrew^^^^Bring five Tamed Kodos and the Kodo Kombobulator back to Smeed Scrabblescrew at Scrabblescrew's Camp.^Bibbly thinks he is the only goblin in Desolace who knows how to make money. Well
column2: the only caravan brave enough to travel these parts relies on me. Ever since I learned how to rejuvenate and control aged and dying kodos with my kodo kombobulator
column3: the caravan owner Cork
column4: Rigger
column5: and I entered a partnership. Take the kombobulator and use it on any ancient
column6: aged
column7: or dying kodos; it will jolt the beast into a tamed kodo and force it to follow you. Once you have a kodo tamed
column8: bring it back to me.

column1: Portals of the Legion^38^Horde^Desolace^Taiga Wisemane^Taiga Wisemane^Hand of Iruxos^^^Banish 6 Portals at Mannoroc Coven and return to Taiga Wisemane at Shadowprey Village.^Behold - the Hand of Iruxos. A gruesome sight indeed. You must possess it if the demon portals at Mannoroc Coven are to be banished... which is what I now ask you to do. The Demon threat is increasing and we must close these portals to stem the tide of demons to this world. Good luck
column2: <name>... and be wary of the portal guardians.

column1: Healthy Dragon Scale^58^All^Scholomance^Healthy Dragon Scale^Betina Bigglezink^^Plagued Hatchlings^^Bring the Healthy Dragon Scale to Betina Bigglezink at the Light's Hope Chapel in Eastern Plaguelands.^This is a scale shed from a plagued dragon hatchling. But unlike the other pocked
column2: oozing scales on the infant beast
column3: this rare scale is healthy and unmarred. Betina Bigglezink will want a sample of this to study.

column1: Sister Pamela^55^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Jessica Redpath^Pamela Redpath^Sister Pamela^^Pamela's Doll^Find Pamela Redpath in Darrowshire.^I fled Lordaeron during the great war
column2: and was lucky to escape before the Scourge swept through my homeland and turned it into a plagued nightmare! I was lucky
column3: but my family was not. I fear they were all killed during the battle of Darrowshire. Darrowshire is a village in the Eastern Kingdoms
column4: nestled in the southern hills of what is now the Eastern Plaguelands. Will you go there and search for my family? I miss them so much
column5: especially my little sister Pamela. Please
column6: find her for me!

column1: Garments of the Moon^4^Night Elf^Priest^Laurna Morninglight^Laurna Morninglight^In Favor of Elune^^^Find Sentinel Shaya and heal her wounds using Lesser Heal (Rank 2). Afterwards
column2: grant her Power Word: Fortitude and then return to Laurna Morninglight in Dolanaar.^I need your help
column3: <name>. I am needed here to train the other students
column4: but you
column5: you can help one of our injured Sentinels just south of Dolanaar. She was hurt patrolling the town and could use our aid. Her name is Shaya. When you find her
column6: heal her wounds
column7: and then fortify her body with your spells. This will at least protect her from harm longer if she finds trouble. Return to me here after you've done your duty to Elune.

column1: In Favor of Elune^4^Night Elf^Priest^Shanda^Laurna Morninglight^In Favor of Elune^^^Speak to Laurna Morninglight in Teldrassil.^<name>
column2: you must travel to Dolanaar when your business here in Shadowglen is done. There
column3: you will find Laurna Morninglight. She will instruct you further in the ways of Elune
column4: and it is with her that you will earn your first garments denoting your station as a <priest/priestess> of Elune. Take care
column5: and may you be protected in your journeys.

column1: In Favor of the Light^4^Alliance^Priest^Priestess Anetta^Priestess Josetta^In Favor of the Light^^Garments of the Light^Speak to Priestess Josetta in Elwynn Forest.^Hello again
column2: young <priest/priestess>. The time has come for you to learn more about our religion. After you've completed whatever tasks you have here in Northshire
column3: please seek out Priestess Josetta in Goldshire. She has more to teach you and has heard that you are growing strong in the ways of the Light. She looks forward to tutoring you more.

column1: Garments of the Light^4^Alliance^Priest^Priestess Josetta^Priestess Josetta^In Favor of the Light^^^Find Guard Roberts and heal his wounds using Lesser Heal (Rank 2). Afterwards
column2: grant him Power Word: Fortitude and then return to Priestess Josetta in Goldshire.^Normally I put forth a small challenge to followers of the Light to test their skill. I want to see if they are worthy of wearing their first robes--a sign that the church outwardly approves of the <priest/priestess> and supports <him/her>. But this situation is a bit different. One of Goldshire's citizens saw an injured guard near the lake to the east of here. His name is Roberts. Find him
column3: heal him
column4: fortify his body and return here. If you can do that for me
column5: then I will consider your test complete.

column1: Garments of the Light^4^Alliance^Priest^Maxan Anvol^Maxan Anvol^In Favor of the Light^^^Find Mountaineer Dolf and heal his wounds using Lesser Heal (Rank 2). Afterwards
column2: grant him Power Word: Fortitude and then return to Maxan Anvol in Kharanos.^It's usually about this time that one of your power is tested to see if they're worthy of wearing robes denoting their place in the church. But to be honest
column3: I got more pressing matters to look into. Citizen of Kharanos' just came in here and told me 'bout a hurt mountaineer just outside town to the south--name's Dolf. You heal Dolf and give him Fortitude
column4: and I'll consider you done with proving yourself. How's that sound?

column1: In Favor of the Light^4^Alliance^Priest^Branstock Khalder^Maxan Anvol^In Favor of the Light^^Garments of the Light^Speak to Maxan Anvol in Dun Morogh.^Hey! <name>! Got a minute?! Ya been following the Light now for long enough that you find your way to Maxan Anvol in Kharanos. He'll teach ya more about the path yer following
column2: and if you prove worthy
column3: give ya yer first set of robes to denote your station as a <priest/priestess>. Now get goin'! As soon as yer done here
column4: head through the tunnel--he'll be waitin' for ya.

column1: Garments of Spirituality^4^Horde^Priest^Tai'jin^Tai'jin^In Favor of Spirituality^^^Find Grunt Kor'ja and heal her wounds using Lesser Heal (Rank 2). Afterwards
column2: grant her Power Word: Fortitude and then return to Tai'jin at Razor Hill.^You be ready for your first test
column3: <name>. South of Razor Hill
column4: just outta town
column5: one of our grunts be hurt fightin' off some o' Proudmoore's old troops. She not doin' too well
column6: an' she benefit much if one of our kind could help her. Find her--her name be Kor'ja--heal her wounds
column7: an' give her the blessin' of our ancestors. You do this
column8: an' me thinks that be sufficient proof that you ready to move on in our ways.

column1: In Favor of Spirituality^4^Horde^Priest^Ken'jai^Tai'jin^In Favor of Spirituality^^Garments of Spirituality^Speak to Tai'jin in Durotar.^Aye
column2: mon. Our kind have joined the Horde because they be good for us. They loyal
column3: and they teach us much 'bout tings like honor. But our old ways die hard. The orcs may not approve of all our traditions
column4: but that not mean we can't continue to practice some them in secret. You know this
column5: an' that's why I send you to Tai'jin in Razor Hill. She teach you more 'bout our history. She teach you the ways of our tribe. Go to her when you be ready.

column1: Garments of Darkness^4^Horde^Priest^Dark Cleric Beryl^Dark Cleric Beryl^In Favor of Darkness^^^Find Deathguard Kel and heal his wounds using Lesser Heal (Rank 2). Afterwards
column2: grant him Power Word: Fortitude and then return to Dark Cleric Beryl in Brill.^Our power comes from darkness and shadow
column3: <name>
column4: but that is not your only role. You have acknowledged that there is merit in knowing the healing arts. This is wise. But before you can know the dark
column5: you must also know the light. And for this
column6: I have a test for you. North of the cemetery is a wounded Deathguard--Deathguard Kel. He has protected us from gnolls for some time
column7: and needs healing. But
column8: you must also fortify his body before he can return to duty. Do both with your spells
column9: and then return to me.

column1: In Favor of Darkness^4^Horde^Priest^Dark Cleric Duesten^Dark Cleric Beryl^In Favor of Darkness^^Garments of Spirituality^Speak to Dark Cleric Beryl in Tirisfal Glades.^There are many lessons that the Forsaken have learned through experience--things that some races can only begin to fathom. And although our path lies in darkness
column2: you will find that a great many things rely on both the light and the dark. Your lessons shall teach you to use both... and with discretion. But heed my words: never forget we were forged in corruption and left to rot like so much carrion. The Darkness is our home. Seek out Dark Cleric Beryl in Brill when you're ready to learn more.

column1: One Shot. One Kill.^15^All^Darkshore^Sentinel Aynasha^Sentinel Onaeya^^^^Protect Sentinel Aynasha
column2: then speak with Onaeya at Maestra's Post in Ashenvale.^I was traveling to Auberdine with an important message when I was attacked by the furbolg Marosh and his trackers. During the attack I was poisoned
column3: leaving me barely able to stand. I can make an antidote
column4: but it will take time before it is ready. I would ask that you defend me until I can apply the antidote. I will aid you with my bow as best I can. Should we survive
column5: I will be able to deliver my message to Auberdine
column6: while you speak with Onaeya at Maestra's Post to inform her of this incident.

column1: The Battle of Darrowshire^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Chromie^Pamela Redpath^Marauders of Darrowshire^^^Place the Relic Bundle at the Darrowshire town square.^Now
column2: <name>
column3: you will take part in battle of Darrowshire
column4: and you will save Joseph Redpath. Place this relic bundle in the Darrowshire town square
column5: and the spirits of Darrowshire will rise. Join their battle and assure that these two things come to pass: Davil must survive beyond the death of Horgus
column6: and Redpath must survive to be corrupted
column7: then defeated. After defeating the corrupted Redpath
column8: his spirit will be saved. Speak with him
column9: then return to his daughter Pamela.

column1: Searching for the Lost Satchel^16^Horde^Ragefire Chasm^Rahauro^Maur Grimtotem^Searching for the Lost Satchel^^^Search Ragefire Chasm for Maur Grimtotem's corpse and search it for any items of interest.^The troggs are not the only thing that interested Magatha in Ragefire Chasm. She has heard word that one of her servants
column2: a Maur Grimtotem
column3: found something peculiar while in the Chasm
column4: but he never made it out to show her what. She'd like Maur's body found--if it still exists--and any signs of what he found while attempting to speak to the troggs. Return to Magatha any items of interest
column5: and I'm sure she would be very generous in her reward. Again
column6: seek the Chasm in the darkest areas of Orgrimmar.

column1: Testing an Enemy's Strength^15^Horde^Ragefire Chasm^Rahauro^Rahauro^^^^Search Orgrimmar for Ragefire Chasm
column2: then kill 8 Ragefire Troggs and 8 Ragefire Shaman before returning to Rahauro in Thunder Bluff.^Beneath the city of Orgrimmar
column3: stout creatures known as troggs started coming to the surface from deep below the lava filled tunnels. In her ever-benevolence
column4: Magatha sought to make peace with the creatures
column5: but they turned on her diplomats
column6: killing them. She will not allow such treatment of the tauren people and now consider the creatures a threat to all of the Horde. She asks that you put an end to this trogg threat before it overwhelms the Horde from below. Find Ragefire Chasm and destroy them all.

column1: Returning the Lost Satchel^16^Horde^Ragefire Chasm^Maur Grimtotem^Rahauro^Searching for the Lost Satchel^^^Take the Grimtotem Satchel to Rahauro in Thunder Bluff.^You find a satchel under the body of the tauren. It is still gripped tightly in his arms as though he was trying to protect it while being attacked by the troggs. Removing the satchel from his vice-like grip
column2: you stow it with your own equipment and prepare to make your way out of the tunnels and back to Rahauro in Thunder Bluff.

column1: Hidden Enemies^12^Horde^Orgrimmar^Thrall^Thrall^^^Hidden Enemies^Bring a Lieutenant's Insignia to Thrall in Orgrimmar.^One thing I will not tolerate are traitors in our midst
column2: <name>. But I would be a fool to play my hand so early--it would not sufficiently cut the corruption out of our lands and only cause the infection to grow worse. But you
column3: a young adventurer
column4: could go places my agents could not... could learn the truth... could find the true head of the beast. If you are brave enough
column5: then enter Skull Rock to the east of Orgrimmar
column6: find a lieutenant's insignia off one of the Burning Blade there
column7: and return to me.

column1: Hidden Enemies^12^Horde^Orgrimmar^Thrall^Thrall^Hidden Enemies^Hidden Enemies^^Take the Lieutenant's Insignia to Neeru Fireblade and speak to him. Gauge if he believes you are a member of the Burning Blade and then return to Thrall in Orgrimmar.^Now let us see if this insignia you found is worth the effort. There is a warlock within the city who believes he has my trust. He does not know that I realize where his true loyalties lie. He is in fact the leader of the Burning Blade. But do not rush off to do battle with him; he has a purpose
column2: and we shall use him against our enemies. Take this insignia to him in the Cleft of Shadow here in Orgrimmar
column3: speak to him and see if he believes you are one of his own
column4: then return to me here.

column1: Hidden Enemies^16^Horde^Ragefire Chasm^Thrall^Thrall^Hidden Enemies^^^Kill Bazzalan and Jergosh the Invoker before returning to Thrall in Orgrimmar.^Hmm
column2: leaders of the Searing Blade... this concerns me most. If they are the ones of value to Neeru
column3: then those are who we must target first. This satyr... Bazzalan
column4: and the other Neeru mentioned--what was he
column5: a warlock?--must be slain. Return to the Cleft of Shadow and enter Ragefire Chasm
column6: <name>. Find these two leaders of the Searing Blade
column7: and kill them. But be careful not to let Neeru know it was you who did this. You must retain your identity as one of his <brothers/sisters> in arms.

column1: Hidden Enemies^15^Horde^Orgrimmar^Thrall^Neeru Fireblade^Hidden Enemies^^^Speak to Neeru Fireblade in Orgrimmar.^I think our next step should be to have you placed close to Neeru. If he is as agitated as reports suggest
column2: then we may accomplish two things. One
column3: you may be able to gain some greater knowledge about the Council or at least the Burning Blade
column4: and two
column5: he may just begin to trust you enough that he asks you to start to aid him. He may very well look at you as someone who can fill the void now that some of the leadership is in turmoil. Return to the Cleft and speak to him again
column6: but do not be too overt.

column1: Hidden Enemies^16^Horde^Orgrimmar^Neeru Fireblade^Thrall^Hidden Enemies^^^Speak to Thrall in Orgrimmar and tell him what you've learned.^You are one of my lieutenants! Prepare yourself
column2: <class>. I will call upon you soon. My time spent on the Searing Blade may be all but wasted now
column3: but that does not mean that the Shadow Council's schemes elsewhere must suffer. I will do what I can to minimize the damage here in Ragefire Chasm. In the meantime
column4: I will have my agents in the Barrens and Ashenvale begin work on our newest agenda. Return to me soon.

column1: Sceptre of Light^33^All^Desolace^Azore Aldamort^Azore Aldamort^Sceptre of Light^^^Get the Sceptre of Light and then return it to Azore Aldamort at the tower in Ethel Rethor.^The Burning Blade in Thunder Axe Fortress to the east is rumored to have acquired the Sceptre of Light from the Naga. Legend tells that the sceptre is able to sink entire cities under the great seas. The Burning Blade must not be allowed to possess such power. To that end
column2: you must retrieve the sceptre yourself! It is held by a Burning Blade seer
column3: who studies the sceptre from atop one of the Thunder Axe watchtowers.

column1: Redemption^56^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Tirion Fordring^Tirion Fordring^Redemption^Demon Dogs^^Listen to what Tirion Fordring has to say.^You have worked hard
column2: friend. Rest your weary bones and allow me to properly introduce myself.

column1: Slaying the Beast^16^All^Ragefire Chasm^Neeru Fireblade^Neeru Fireblade^^^^Enter Ragefire Chasm and slay Taragaman the Hungerer
column2: then bring his heart back to Neeru Fireblade in Orgrimmar.^The primary task set upon me by our great Warchief is to root out the creatures responsible for infesting our lord's great city with demonic influence. The Burning Blade is one threat
column3: but there are others; the Searing Blade for instance
column4: who make their home in Ragefire Chasm
column5: secretly attempting to subvert innocent members of the Horde. If they are to be stopped
column6: then their leader must be slain--a Felguard named Taragaman the Hungerer. Kill him
column7: and his heart will appease Thrall
column8: of this I'm sure.

column1: Hemet Nesingwary Jr.^31^All^Thousand Needles^Kravel Koalbeard^Hemet Nesingwary Jr.^^^^Take Kravel's Crate to Hemet Nesingwary Jr. in Stranglethorn Vale.^I have a package for a new customer of mine
column2: a dwarf named Hemet Nesingwary Jr.. The package took weeks to arrive
column3: and Hemet's long gone by now. He said he was going to Stranglethorn to take his father's place and hunt the beasts there
column4: but he left me some money to send his delivery when I could. Junior's a rich dwarf and it's a good idea to keep up relations with the rich ones
column5: yeah? So... you want to deliver the package for me? I heard he has a camp in Stranglethorn
column6: north of Grom'gol.

column1: Hunting in Stranglethorn^31^Horde^Desolace^Roon Wildmane^Hemet Nesingwary Jr.^^^^Bring Roon's Kodo Horn to Hemet Nesingwary Jr. in Stranglethorn Vale.^Long ago
column2: a dwarf came to this land. His name was Hemet and he wished to hunt great beasts. His skills with the rifle were uncanny
column3: and we spent many days hunting together. Even the enmity between our peoples was forgotten. When he left for Stranglethorn
column4: I vowed to one day welcome him back. Now he has gone on to hunt in lands unknown
column5: but his son has taken his place. Take this kodo horn as a gift to Hemet Jr.. You will find him in Stranglethorn
column6: north of the Grom'gol Base camp.

column1: Of Forgotten Memories^57^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Tirion Fordring^Tirion Fordring^Redemption^^^Travel to the Undercroft - at the southernmost section of the Eastern Plaguelands - and recover Taelan's Hammer. Return to Tirion Fordring upon completion of your objective.^To help Taelan regain what he has lost
column2: you must gather items from his past. The first such item is a toy that I gave to him on his 7th birthday. It was his most cherished possession: A miniature war hammer; an exact replica of my very own. After I was banished for treason
column3: his mother told him that I had died. He was taken to my false grave at the Undercroft
column4: where he buried the hammer along with my memory - forever. You must venture to the Undercroft and recover Taelan's hammer.

column1: Fire Plume Forged^57^Alliance^Tanaris^Krinkle Goodsteel^Alchemist Arbington^Scholomance^^^Take the Skeleton Key Mold and 2 Thorium Bars to the top of Fire Plume Ridge in Un'Goro Crater. Use the Skeleton Key Mold by the lava lake to forge the Unfinished Skeleton Key.^You need two bars of thorium and a powerfully hot heat source to forge the key stem. You're on your own for the thorium
column2: but I can help with the heat. To our west in Un'Goro Crater is Fire Plume Ridge - a simmering volcano. The lava lake up top is hot enough to fuse thorium and bone together. Your gold has bought you a mold that simply requires you to dip it in the lake up top; the lava will take care of the rest. That's it on my end. To finish your key
column3: you'll need to talk to Arbington again.

column1: Fire Plume Forged^57^Horde^Tanaris^Krinkle Goodsteel^Apothecary Dithers^Scholomance^^^Take the Skeleton Key Mold and 2 Thorium Bars to the top of Fire Plume Ridge in Un'Goro Crater. Use the Skeleton Key Mold by the lava lake to forge the Unfinished Skeleton Key.^You need two bars of thorium and a powerfully hot heat source to forge the key stem. You're on your own for the thorium
column2: but I can help with the heat. To our west in Un'Goro Crater is Fire Plume Ridge - a simmering volcano. The lava lake up top is hot enough to fuse thorium and bone together. Your gold has bought you a mold that simply requires you to dip it in the lake up top; the lava will take care of the rest. That's it on my end. To finish your key
column3: you'll need to talk to Dithers again.

column1: Araj's Scarab^60^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Alchemist Arbington^Alchemist Arbington^Scholomance^^The Key to Scholomance^Destroy Araj the Summoner and bring Araj's Scarab to Alchemist Arbington at Chillwind Point
column2: Western Plaguelands.^Araj the Summoner lords over Andorhal from the ruined city's heart. We know that he was the former leader of Scholomance before claiming the city as his own. To finish the key
column3: we will need his signet - called a scarab - mounted as the head of the key. Make your way into the heart of Andorhal
column4: and break his hold on the city now that he is drawn into the open. Once destroyed
column5: seize his scarab from his fallen phylactery! The Key to Scholomance awaits
column6: <name>!

column1: Araj's Scarab^60^Horde^Western Plaguelands^Apothecary Dithers^Apothecary Dithers^Scholomance^^The Key to Scholomance^Destroy Araj the Summoner and bring Araj's Scarab to Apothecary Dithers at the Bulwark
column2: Western Plaguelands.^Araj the Summoner lords over Andorhal from the ruined city's heart. We know that he was the former leader of Scholomance before claiming the city as his own. To finish the key
column3: we will need his signet - called a scarab - mounted as the head of the key. Make your way into the heart of Andorhal
column4: and break his hold on the city now that he is drawn into the open. Once destroyed
column5: seize his scarab from his fallen phylactery! The Key to Scholomance awaits
column6: <name>!

column1: Bodyguard for Hire^35^All^Desolace^Cork Gizelton^Smeed Scrabblescrew^^^^Escort the Gizelton Caravan past the Kolkar Centaur village. Talk with Smeed at Scrabblescrew's Camp for your reward.^Under normal circumstances
column2: Rigger and I would lead our kodo past the Kolkar Centaur. Every now and then we hear the Centaur war drums
column3: and when we hear those we stop. It's not good for business to be dead! I'll tell you what <class>
column4: if you protect us past the Kolkar village we'll make it worth your while. It's just a short distance
column5: all you need to do is keep the caravan intact and you can pick up your reward from Smeed Scrabblescrew - he is down the road a bit. We do a little business together.

column1: Of Lost Honor^58^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Tirion Fordring^Tirion Fordring^Redemption^^^Travel to Northdale
column2: in the northeastern region of the Eastern Plaguelands
column3: and recover the Symbol of Lost Honor. Return to Tirion Fordring upon completion of your objective.^The Order of the Silver Hand was utterly decimated when Uther was slain. The boy held out for as long as he could. Pushed to the war torn hamlet of Northdale
column4: he made his final stand. Were any of the Order left alive
column5: he thought - and did it matter? It was with that thought that Taelan threw down the standard of the Order and renounced all that he had known. His honor left upon the blood soaked ground of Northdale. You must travel to Northdale and recover that symbol of lost honor.

column1: Of Love and Family^58^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Tirion Fordring^Artist Renfray^Redemption^^^Travel to island of Caer Darrow
column2: in the south-central region of the Plaguelands
column3: and look for any clues as to the whereabouts of the painting.^When Taelan was a child
column4: we would oft visit Caer Darrow on family excursions. On our last visit
column5: an artist by the name of Renfray painted a portrait of us poised along the beachside. It is my fondest memory of both Taelan and Karandra. For it was at that moment
column6: with my wife and son in my arms
column7: that I felt a bond of love and family that I would never know again. If this painting still exists
column8: you must find it. Travel to the ruined island of Caer Darrow and see if the painting or the artist remain.

column1: Of Love and Family^60^All^Stratholme^Artist Renfray^Tirion Fordring^Redemption^^^Travel to Stratholme
column2: in the northern part of the Plaguelands. It is in the Scarlet Bastion that you will find the painting 'Of Love and Family
column3: ' hidden behind another painting depicting the twin moons of our world.^The painting... It hung on the wall of my workshop - inside the Order's barracks - for years. After Tirion's trial was over
column4: I knew that I could no longer keep the painting visible. I hid it in a place that they would never think to look. Travel to Stratholme and make your way deep inside what is now the Scarlet Bastion
column5: search for a painting of our twin moons. Chip away at the paint until you uncover my master work
column6: 'Of Love and Family.' May the Light guide your actions.

column1: Find Myranda^60^All^Western Plaguelands^Tirion Fordring^Myranda the Hag^Redemption^^^Travel to Uther's Tomb
column2: located in the southern Plaguelands. Show Myranda the Hag Tirion's Gift.^<name>
column3: you have done all that I have asked thus far. Only one step remains in your quest of redemption. You must deliver the items you have collected to Taelan. Unfortunately
column4: Taelan and his Scarlet Crusaders will attack you on sight. There is only one way in which to deliver my message and that is through a guise of deception. To the south you will find Uther's tomb. An old and trusted confidant of mine
column5: Myranda
column6: now resides there - seek her out. Show her the items and she will assist you.

column1: Scarlet Subterfuge^60^All^Western Plaguelands^Myranda the Hag^Highlord Taelan Fordring^Redemption^^In Dreams^Speak to Myranda to gain the Scarlet Illusion. Travel to Hearthglen while under the Scarlet Illusion and deliver Tirion's Gift to Highlord Taelan Fordring.^I am what you would call
column2: an illusionist. Though I may be able to create an illusion to allow you entry into Hearthglen
column3: be warned; my powers have their limitations. Should you travel too far from these lands
column4: the effects of the illusion will cease. The spell itself takes a great amount of concentration and power from me
column5: and thus
column6: I can only sustain the effect for a short time. Speak to me again when you are ready.

column1: The Dunemaul Compound^49^All^Tanaris^Andi Lynn^Andi Lynn^^^^Andi Lynn in Gadgetzan wants you to destroy the Dunemaul Compound by killing 10 Dunemaul Brutes
column2: 10 Dunemaul Enforcers
column3: and Gor'marok the Ravager.^Just recently
column4: a large band of nomadic ogres arrived in Tanaris. South of here
column5: they have taken over a large area of the desert and formed a compound. Several smaller bands are currently wandering the desert
column6: some of which have invaded the old troll ruins. The Dunemaul Compound must be destroyed! We cannot allow these ogres to build up a force. The leader of this band is named Gor'marok the Ravager; I believe that putting an end to his leadership will be the beginning of the end for the ogres.

column1: Irondeep Supplies^51^Alliance^Alterac Valley^Stormpike Quartermaster^Stormpike Quartermaster^^^^Bring 10 Irondeep Supplies to the Alliance Quartermaster in Dun Baldar.^Before the fighting started
column2: we stored supplies for Dun Baldar in the Irondeep mine. The troggs that surfaced there weren't much of a problem when we had spare troops to guard the mine
column3: but now that we're fighting with the Horde we can't maintain control of Irondeep. We need the supplies in Irondeep
column4: <name>. Enter the mine and bring me a load of them.

column1: Coldtooth Supplies^51^Horde^Alterac Valley^Frostwolf Quartermaster^Frostwolf Quartermaster^^^^Bring 10 Coldtooth Supplies to the Horde Quatermaster in Frostwolf Keep.^The Coldtooth mine to the north was once an ideal place to store extra supplies
column2: but now that the fighting with the Stormpikes grows fierce
column3: we do not always have the spare warriors to station at the mine and protect it. And so
column4: control of the mine often falls to the Alliance
column5: or to underground denizens... But we still need our supplies
column6: <name>! Go to the Coldtooth mine and bring me a load of them. And be wary of enemies as you go; the tides of battle shift quickly in that place...

column1: A Plague Upon Thee^55^Horde^Eastern Plaguelands^Mickey Levine^Mickey Levine^A Plague Upon Thee^^^Use the Empty Termite Jar on the Termite Mounds in Eastern Plaguelands. After you've gathered 100 Plagueland Termites
column2: return to Mickey Levine at the Bulwark in Tirisfal Glades.^So
column3: to bring pain and strife to the Scarlet Crusade
column4: I want to take their precious lumber mill from them. I'm sure the loss of such a resource will cause them a great deal of harm in defending and rebuilding the town for their own reasons. Will you help me
column5: <name>? Start by taking this jar to Plaguewood in the Eastern Plaguelands. Fill it with the termites you find in their mounds throughout the woods. Come back when you have enough.

column1: A Plague Upon Thee^55^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Mickey Levine^Termite Barrel^A Plague Upon Thee^^^Find someplace suitable in the center of the Northridge Lumber Mill in Western Plaguelands to place the Barrel of Plagueland Termites.^Now that we have plenty of termites
column2: take this steel reinforced barrel to the Northridge Lumber Mill south of Hearthglen--you'll find it to the west of the road that leads you up to the town. Once there
column3: place the barrel in the center of the lumber mill; someplace high
column4: like on a crate or something. After you open it
column5: the rest should take care of itself. Just come back here and I'll reward you for helping me.

column1: A Plague Upon Thee^55^Alliance^Eastern Plaguelands^Nathaniel Dumah^Nathaniel Dumah^A Plague Upon Thee^^^Use the Empty Termite Jar on the Termite Mounds in Eastern Plaguelands. After you've gathered 100 Plagueland Termites
column2: return to Nathaniel Dumah at Chillwind Camp in Western Plaguelands.^I've tried many times to rout out the Scarlet Crusade through force alone
column3: but to no avail. So
column4: as an alternative
column5: I've decided to make their lives more difficult. If you are willing to help
column6: I want to infest that lumber mill with the most terrible species of termites ever found. In Plaguewood
column7: near the once-great Stratholme
column8: there is a breed that survived the plague and the Scourge combined. Find their mounds and fill this jar with them
column9: so we can prepare them to be unleashed on the Crusade.

column1: A Plague Upon Thee^55^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Nathaniel Dumah^Termite Barrel^A Plague Upon Thee^^^Find someplace suitable in the center of the Northridge Lumber Mill in Western Plaguelands to place the Barrel of Plagueland Termites.^Now that we have the termites
column2: take this steel reinforced barrel to the Northridge Lumber Mill south of Hearthglen--you'll find it to the west of the road that leads you up to the town. Once there
column3: place the barrel in the center of the lumber mill; find someplace suitable
column4: like on a crate and then open it. The termites should do their work from there and make the mill useless to the Crusade.

column1: Moonglade^10^Night Elf^Druid^Mathrengyl Bearwalker^Dendrite Starblaze^Heeding the Call^^Great Bear Spirit^Use the spell "Teleport: Moonglade" to travel to Moonglade. When you arrive
column2: speak with Dendrite Starblaze in the village of Nighthaven.^All druids are welcome in the sacred lands of Moonglade
column3: regardless of the current tensions in the Cenarion Circle between Arch Druid Staghelm and Keeper Remulos - Moonglade's guardian. Now that you're learning the ways of the Claw
column4: I'll teach you the spell that lets you transport yourself there. Cast it whenever you seek Moonglade's knowledge or solace. As for your first lesson
column5: travel to Moonglade and speak with Dendrite Starblaze in Nighthaven about the path you're now on. Good luck
column6: young druid.

column1: Moonglade^10^Tauren^Druid^Turak Runetotem^Dendrite Starblaze^Heeding the Call^^Great Bear Spirit^Use the spell "Teleport: Moonglade" to travel to Moonglade. When you arrive
column2: speak with Dendrite Starblaze in the village of Nighthaven.^All druids are welcomed to the sacred lands of Moonglade
column3: tauren and night elf alike. Keeper Remulos - Moonglade's guardian - keeps watch over all druids who hibernate there. Now that you're learning the ways of the Claw
column4: I'll teach you the spell that lets you transport yourself there. Cast it whenever you seek Moonglade's knowledge or solace. As for your first lesson
column5: travel to Moonglade and speak with Dendrite Starblaze in Nighthaven about the path you're now on. Good luck
column6: young druid.

column1: Heeding the Call^10^Night Elf^Druid^Kal^Mathrengyl Bearwalker^Heeding the Call^^^Speak with Mathrengyl Bearwalker in the Cenarion Enclave
column2: Darnassus.^Excuse me
column3: friend... It has come to my attention that Mathrengyl Bearwalker has put out word that he wishes to speak with you. It seems that your training as a druid is about to take on a new life
column4: and he will be training you personally. Mathrengyl is the direct assistant to the Arch Druid himself
column5: and is one of the most sage and august druids you'll find in Teldrassil. He is located in the Cenarion Enclave of Darnassus
column6: on the second floor of Fandral Staghelm's tree.

column1: Heeding the Call^10^Night Elf^Druid^Theridran^Mathrengyl Bearwalker^Heeding the Call^^^Speak with Mathrengyl Bearwalker in the Cenarion Enclave
column2: Darnassus.^Excuse me
column3: friend... It has come to my attention that Mathrengyl Bearwalker has put out word that he wishes to speak with you. It seems that your training as a druid is about to take on a new life
column4: and he will be training you personally. Mathrengyl is the direct assistant to the Arch Druid himself
column5: and is one of the most sage and august druids you'll find in Teldrassil. He is located in the Cenarion Enclave of Darnassus
column6: on the second floor of Fandral Staghelm's tree.

column1: Heeding the Call^10^Night Elf^Druid^Shalannius^Mathrengyl Bearwalker^Heeding the Call^^^Speak with Mathrengyl Bearwalker in the Cenarion Enclave
column2: Darnassus.^Excuse me
column3: friend... It has come to my attention that Mathrengyl Bearwalker has put out word that he wishes to speak with you. It seems that your training as a druid is about to take on a new life
column4: and he will be training you personally. Mathrengyl is the direct assistant to the Arch Druid himself
column5: and is one of the most sage and august druids you'll find in Teldrassil. He is located in the Cenarion Enclave of Darnassus
column6: on the second floor of Fandral Staghelm's tree.

column1: Heeding the Call^10^Tauren^Druid^Gennia Runetotem^Turak Runetotem^Heeding the Call^^Lessons Anew^Speak with Turak Runetotem on the Elder Rise of Thunder Bluff.^Excuse me
column2: friend... It has come to my attention that Turak Runetotem has put out word that he wishes to speak with you. It seems that your training as a druid is about to take on a new life
column3: and he will be training you personally. Turak is one of the Arch Druid's assistants; he is known as a wise and patient druid
column4: and he should teach you well. He is located in Thunder Bluff
column5: inside the Cenarion Circle's main tent on the Elder Rise.

column1: Heeding the Call^10^Tauren^Druid^Gart Mistrunner^Turak Runetotem^Heeding the Call^^Lessons Anew^Speak with Turak Runetotem on the Elder Rise of Thunder Bluff.^Excuse me
column2: friend... It has come to my attention that Turak Runetotem has put out word that he wishes to speak with you. It seems that your training as a druid is about to take on a new life
column3: and he will be training you personally. Turak is one of the Arch Druid's assistants; he is known as a wise and patient druid
column4: and he should teach you well. He is located in Thunder Bluff
column5: inside the Cenarion Circle's main tent on the Elder Rise.

column1: Heeding the Call^10^Tauren^Druid^Harene Plainwalker^Turak Runetotem^Heeding the Call^^Lessons Anew^Speak with Turak Runetotem on the Elder Rise of Thunder Bluff.^Excuse me
column2: friend... It has come to my attention that Turak Runetotem has put out word that he wishes to speak with you. It seems that your training as a druid is about to take on a new life
column3: and he will be training you personally. Turak is one of the Arch Druid's assistants; he is known as a wise and patient druid
column4: and he should teach you well. He is located in Thunder Bluff
column5: inside the Cenarion Circle's main tent on the Elder Rise.

column1: Great Bear Spirit^10^Night Elf^Druid^Dendrite Starblaze^Dendrite Starblaze^Heeding the Call^^Back to Darnassus^Seek out the Great Bear Spirit in northwestern Moonglade and learn what it has to share with you about the nature of the bear. When finished
column2: return to Dendrite Starblaze in Nighthaven
column3: Moonglade.^In the northwest part of Moonglade resides the home of a wise and noble being we call the Great Bear Spirit. For all druids
column4: it has served as a tutor and mentor into the first true natural understanding of the bear. All druids at one point seek the spirit's wisdom
column5: and you shall be no exception. Go to the Great Bear Spirit now and learn what it will teach. When it is satisfied with you
column6: return to me here in Nighthaven. We will then see if you have truly taken account of the lessons it teaches.

column1: Great Bear Spirit^10^Tauren^Druid^Dendrite Starblaze^Dendrite Starblaze^Heeding the Call^^Back to Thunder Bluff^Seek out the Great Bear Spirit in northwestern Moonglade and learn what it has to share with you about the nature of the bear. When finished
column2: return to Dendrite Starblaze in Nighthaven
column3: Moonglade.^In the northwest part of Moonglade resides the home of a wise and noble being we call the Great Bear Spirit. For all druids
column4: it has served as a tutor and mentor into the first true natural understanding of the bear. All druids at one point seek the spirit's wisdom
column5: and you shall be no exception. Go to the Great Bear Spirit now and learn what it will teach. When it is satisfied with you
column6: return to me here in Nighthaven. We will then see if you have truly taken account of the lessons it teaches.

column1: Back to Darnassus^10^Night Elf^Druid^Dendrite Starblaze^Mathrengyl Bearwalker^Heeding the Call^^Body and Heart^Return to Darnassus and speak with Mathrengyl Bearwalker in the Cenarion Enclave.^The time has come for us to part ways
column2: young one
column3: as the application of your lessons takes you back to whom that sent you to me. Mathrengyl Bearwalker walks truly in balance with nature
column4: even as he dwells precariously close to where the balance has faltered. Listen to his instructions
column5: and you will soon complete your first lessons into your role as a protector of balance. Go now
column6: young one. We shall meet again.

column1: Back to Thunder Bluff^10^Tauren^Druid^Dendrite Starblaze^Turak Runetotem^Heeding the Call^^Body and Heart^Return to Thunder Bluff and speak with Turak Runetotem on the Elder Rise.^The time has come for us to part ways
column2: young one
column3: as the application of your lessons takes you back to whom that sent you to me. Though the tauren are thought to be young in the ways of Cenarius
column4: Turak Runetotem walks with much balance in the presence of nature. Listen to his instructions
column5: and you will soon complete your first lessons into your role as a protector of balance. Go now
column6: young one. We shall meet again.

column1: Return to Chromie^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Carlin Redpath^Chromie^Marauders of Darrowshire^^^Take the Bundle of Relics to Chromie in Andorhal.^You have gathered many relics of the battle of Darrowshire. Each time you returned with more
column2: my heart yearned for my village... yearned to protect it from its fate. I know that cannot be
column3: but Chromie
column4: that strange gnome in Andorhal
column5: tells me it is possible. She says you can save Darrowshire! She asked me to gather together the relics
column6: and to have you bring them to her. She said that she awaits you in the ruined inn of Andorhal.

column1: Hidden Treasures^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Pamela Redpath^Joseph's Chest^Marauders of Darrowshire^^^Bring Joseph's Key to Joseph's Chest.^Daddy told me to give you this key. He said it opens a chest out back behind the house. He also wanted me to thank you. Did you do a favor for him? Did you tell him you found my doll? Well here's the key. And thank you <name>. Thank you! You're a very nice <man/lady>!

Gizelton Caravan^38^All^Desolace^Rigger Gizelton^Smeed Scrabblescrew^^^^Escort the Gizelton Caravan through Mannoroc Coven. Talk with Smeed at Scrabblescrew's Camp for your reward.^You look like a capable <race>. Perhaps you're looking to make some money? Cork and I started this caravan to make a bundle of money; little did we know the dangers of turning a buck! Up ahead is Mannoroc Coven... normally the demons ignore us but something has the kodos spooked this time. I'll pay you to protect the caravan past Mannoroc Coven. Once we are safely past you can receive your reward from our business associate Smeed at Scrabblescrew's Camp.
In Dreams^60^All^Western Plaguelands^Highlord Taelan Fordring^Tirion Fordring^^Scarlet Subterfuge^^Escort Taelan Fordring out of Hearthglen.^For so long
column2: I have been a puppet of the Grand Crusader. What reason was there to fight against what the Scarlet Crusade had become? It has been decades
column3: yet the memories of my father; those precious memories
column4: they are what have kept me alive. I have dreams
column5: stranger. In these dreams my father is with me. He stands proudly at my side as I am inducted into the Order. We battle legion of Scourge
column6: side by side. We bring honor to the Alliance
column7: to Lordaeron. I want not to dream anymore. Take me to him.

column1: The Champion of the Banshee Queen^56^Horde^Undercity^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner^Nathanos Blightcaller^^^^Speak with Nathanos Blightcaller in the Eastern Plaguelands. He is said to have taken up residence at the Marris Stead.^It pleases me greatly to see the battle hardened join our cause. Our numbers grow in size and strength as each day passes. Perhaps you are prepared to test your mettle
column2: <class>? Among the first of my champions was Nathanos
column3: now known as the Blightcaller. Few exist with more dedication or vigor amidst our ranks. Seek him out in the Eastern Plaguelands. He resides at the Marris Stead; occasionally roaming the decimated wastes
column4: slaying all Scourge and Alliance filth that cross his path.

column1: Rampaging Giants^60^Alliance^Winterspring^Rivern Frostwind^Rivern Frostwind^^^^Rivern Frostwind wants you to kill 4 Frostmaul Giants and 4 Frostmaul Preservers.^Around 4
column2: 000 years ago
column3: Tyrande Whisperwind saved the life of the frostsaber queen
column4: at the hands of rampaging giants. Since then
column5: the frostsabers have been allies of the night elves. These same giants that once were a danger to the frostsabers
column6: still exist not too far from here. They are called the frostmaul
column7: and they have taken over the large valley to the south. Prove your loyalty to the frostsabers; kill these giants in the name of the frostsaber queen
column8: Shy-Rotam!

column1: Body and Heart^10^Night Elf^Druid^Mathrengyl Bearwalker^Mathrengyl Bearwalker^Heeding the Call^^^Use the Cenarion Moondust on the Moonkin Stone of Auberdine to bring forth Lunaclaw. From there
column2: you must face Lunaclaw and earn the strength of body and heart it possesses.^Directly east of Auberdine lay many moonkin caves. The one closest to Auberdine has a Moonkin Stone inside it. Lunaclaw
column3: the defender of the stone
column4: will face you only when Cenarion Moondust is applied to it. Lunaclaw possesses within it a strength that you must use as one of the Claw. You've earned the right to use this Cenarion Moondust
column5: <name>... now show me that you've earned the right to possess the strength of body and the strength of heart needed as a druid!

column1: Unfinished Business^56^All^Western Plaguelands^Kirsta Deepshadow^Kirsta Deepshadow^Unfinished Business^^^Kill 2 Scarlet Medics
column2: 2 Scarlet Hunters
column3: 2 Scarlet Magi and 2 Scarlet Knights before returning to Kirsta Deepshadow in Western Plaguelands.^I was sent as a scout to do some damage and gauge the strength of Hearthglen's defenses. Some people in the Alliance feel the little town has more than historical importance. It's not my job to question what that importance is
column4: but regardless
column5: I'm in no shape to continue until I rest up. If you're willing
column6: I'd pay handsomely for some help. Start south of here at their camp near the small bulwark they've set up. If you prove strong enough
column7: maybe I could get your help with my main goal.

column1: Zaeldarr the Outcast^55^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Caretaker Alen^Caretaker Alen^^^^Bring Zaeldarr's Head to Caretaker Alen at Light's Hope Chapel.^Can you believe that
column2: after all the trouble we have in the plaguelands... we have to worry about thieves too? And not just normal thieves
column3: troll thieves. And not just normal troll thieves. Dead troll thieves! They're led by this big
column4: dead troll named Zaeldarr the Outcast
column5: and they come here at night and steal bodies from the pit below
column6: then take them back to their evil
column7: dead troll hideout--the Undercroft to the west. Go there and take out Zaeldarr
column8: <name>. I'm sick to death of his mischief!

column1: To Kill With Purpose^58^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Nathanos Blightcaller^Nathanos Blightcaller^^^^Travel to Corin's Crossing to the east and slaughter the Scourge that inhabit the town. Collect 7 pieces of Living Rot in under 10 minutes. Use the Mortar and Pestle to grind the Living Rot into Coagulated Rot.^You kill with purpose while you remain on my stead. Your first task is to feed my hounds. Take this mortar and pestle and travel to Corin's Crossing. Once there
column2: you will find a robust selection of Scourge to slaughter. From their fresh carcasses I need living rot. Take that living rot and grind it up in the mortar
column3: then let it sit to coagulate. Bring the coagulated rot back here. And imbecile
column4: realize that living rot from the undead doesn't remain 'living' for very long. You must kill quickly!

column1: Unfinished Business^57^All^Western Plaguelands^Kirsta Deepshadow^Kirsta Deepshadow^Unfinished Business^^^Kill Huntsman Radley and Cavalier Durgen before returning to Kirsta Deepshadow in Western Plaguelands.^My real mission was to weaken the Scarlet Crusade's outlying forces and then infiltrate Hearthglen to gauge their numbers. I'm still in no shape to do it on my own
column2: so perhaps I could ask you to aid me again
column3: <name>? From what information I gathered before being discovered
column4: the Crusade has two important members that are the backbone of their forces outside the town: Huntsman Radley and Cavalier Durgen. Kill them
column5: and we're making progress. They should be along Hearthglen Pass outside the town proper.

column1: Hameya's Plea^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Torn Scroll^Mound of Dirt^^^^Kill Infiltrator Hameya. Use his key on the Mound of Dirt behind the Undercroft.^Kill me. Before it's too late. I am Hameya. While traveling to Zul'Mashar
column2: my brethren and I ate some bad meat... and we changed. We are infected. I can feel the lich's words now
column3: urging me to reach Zul'Mashar and infect more of my people. I cannot resist
column4: and so I wrote this scroll before my will left me. I buried a chest in dirt next to a wagon behind this crypt
column5: but only my key will open it. I have the key. If you want my treasure
column6: then find me. Kill me. Before it's too late.

column1: Unfinished Business^58^All^Western Plaguelands^Kirsta Deepshadow^Kirsta Deepshadow^Unfinished Business^^^Enter Hearthglen and find a high vantage point from which you can see the town and gauge the Scarlet Crusade's forces
column2: then return to Kirsta Deepshadow in Western Plaguelands.^What? Really? You want to know more? But you've already done so much for me
column3: <name>. I couldn't possibly ask you to enter Hearthglen itself on my behalf. Are you sure
column4: <name>? Hearthglen is much more dangerous than the Pass--I cannot provide you any protection or even information about what you might face. Well
column5: if you really are willing to help
column6: then enter the town and find a high place to gain a good view of the town. From there you can gauge their numbers and report them back to me. But be careful....

column1: That's Asking A Lot^58^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Smokey LaRue^Smokey LaRue^That's Asking A Lot^^^Smokey LaRue wants you to get 2 Thorium Bars
column2: 1 Golden Rod
column3: 8 Hi-Explosive Bombs
column4: and 8 Unstable Triggers.^These here Argent Dawn people commissioned ol' Smokey to do a little demolition work for 'em. Smokey's mammy ain't raised no dummy. When gold coin is slapped on the table
column5: Smokey's services are available. That's my motto! Now I'd be willing to split the commission with you if you're willing to do a little legwork. Here's the deal: I'm going to head over to Plaguewood and mark the buildings we need destroyed. You gather the components for the bombs. Meet back here when you've got everything. Deal?

column1: Book of the Ancients^38^All^Desolace^Azore Aldamort^Azore Aldamort^Sceptre of Light^^^Get the Book of the Ancients and return it to Azore Aldamort at the tower in Ethel Rethor.^<name>
column2: I entrust you with the Gem of the Serpent. Place this gem on the Serpent Statue's hand on Ranazjar Isle
column3: a small island northwest of here. Placing it will summon the one who protects the Book of the Ancients. This book contains the secrets of the naga
column4: secrets that have been kept for centuries. Bring this book to me
column5: and we will learn much about our scaled foes!

column1: The Everlook Report^52^Alliance^Winterspring^Gregor Greystone^Argent Officer Pureheart^^^^Deliver the Everlook Report to Argent Officer Pureheart at Chillwind Camp
column2: Western Plaguelands.^I am looking for a responsible individual to aid me in a small but nonetheless important matter. I'm here as a representative of the Argent Dawn's interests to the local governance of Everlook. I need to get a progress report to Argent Officer Pureheart at Chillwind Camp; it's a ways from here
column3: located along the southern fringe of the Western Plaguelands. If I may be so bold - this would be a perfect means to introduce yourself to my superior and perhaps earn some work from her!

column4: however

column5: allowing us to become closer to the Earthmother. In the same way

column7: you will learn to tame a beast of your choosing. But all things take practice
