column2: I need some earthroot. Herbalists know how to find it
column3: so if we're unlucky and you aren't one then you'll need to find one to help us out. Finally for potency
column4: I need some lunar fungus. Finding lunar fungal blooms is easy enough; they're all over the place in caves just to the east of here. Moonkin reside in the caves and they're irritable as of late
column5: so be careful.

column1: Curing the Sick^14^Alliance^Druid^Alanndarian Nightsong^Dendrite Starblaze^Lessons Anew^^^Use the Curative Animal Salve on 10 Sickly Deer that are located throughout Darkshore; doing so should cure them. Sickly Deer have been reported starting south of the Cliffspring River to the north of Auberdine and extending all the way into southern Darkshore where the edge of Ashenvale begins.^The amount of salve made out of the reagents you brought me is good enough for ten doses
column2: <name>. While I work with the village to try and make some more salve
column3: I'd like for you to help us get a head start. All around Darkshore are sickly deer; use the salve on them and cure their malaise. Dendrite Starblaze in Moonglade will want to talk to you when you're done
column4: I'm sure. Please extend Auberdine's thanks to the Cenarion Circle there... and let me say thanks to you directly for the help you've given!

column1: Power over Poison^14^Alliance^Druid^Dendrite Starblaze^Mathrengyl Bearwalker^Lessons Anew^^^Return to Mathrengyl Bearwalker in the Cenarion Enclave
column2: Darnassus.^You've learned what it means to cure poison without the benefit of spiritual aid. Remember what others must endure in fighting poisonous afflictions as you soon embrace your newfound power over poison. You should now return to Mathrengyl Bearwalker in Darnassus
column3: <name>. He
column4: no doubt
column5: has a very important spell to teach you now that the student understands the lesson given unto <him /her>. Farewell
column6: young druid. We shall speak again.

column1: Lessons Anew^14^Horde^Druid^Turak Runetotem^Dendrite Starblaze^Lessons Anew^^^Travel to Moonglade and speak with Dendrite Starblaze in the village of Nighthaven.^You're now ready to learn about poison and the power we as druids have over it
column2: <name>. Cenarius has blessed us with the ability to purge even the most foul of poisons with but a mere incantation. This gift is not to be taken lightly... and to ensure you learn this lesson
column3: you'll work to address the effects of poisonings as a layman would. Travel to Moonglade and speak with Dendrite Starblaze; he awaits your arrival to begin your lesson.

column1: The Principal Source^14^Horde^Druid^Dendrite Starblaze^Tonga Runetotem^Lessons Anew^^^Use the Empty Dreadmist Peak Sampler to draw a sample of water from a pool at the top of the peak.^Dreadmist Peak to the northwest of the Crossroads is most likely a primary candidate as to the source of the spread of the poison. Its airy peaks have pools of water that influence the weather patterns. I suspect the water is now tainted by the demon-worshipping Burning Blade. Use this sampler to draw water from the pool at the very top of the peak. Once filled
column2: deliver it to Tonga Runetotem at the Crossroads. He is the one that requested our aid
column3: and you will work with him to address this malady.

column1: Gathering the Cure^14^Horde^Druid^Tonga Runetotem^Tonga Runetotem^Lessons Anew^^^Bring 5 Earthroot and 5 Kodo Horns to Tonga Runetotem at the Crossroads so he may make a curative salve.^The water will serve as the base of the curative salve I shall make for the gazelles. For curative properties
column2: I need some earthroot. Herbalists know how to find it
column3: so if you are not familiar with this skill you'll need to find one to help us out. Finally for potency
column4: I need kodo horns - mere chips and fragments will not suffice. Kodos you can handle wander the northern part of the Barrens; bring some down for the greater good of the balance <name>
column5: and fetch the horns for me.

column1: Curing the Sick^14^Horde^Druid^Tonga Runetotem^Dendrite Starblaze^Lessons Anew^^^Use the Curative Animal Salve on 10 Sickly Gazelles that are located throughout the northern part of the Barrens; doing so should cure them. Sickly Gazelles have been reported north of the east-west road that runs through the Crossroads.^I was able to make enough salve for ten doses of curing
column2: <name>. While I work with local authorities to try and make some more salve
column3: I'd like for you to help us get a head start. All around the northern Barrens are sickly gazelles; use the salve on them and cure their malaise. Dendrite Starblaze in Moonglade will want to talk to you when you're done
column4: I'm sure. Please extend our thanks to the Cenarion Circle there... and let me say thanks to you directly for the help you've given!

column1: Power over Poison^14^Horde^Druid^Dendrite Starblaze^Turak Runetotem^Lessons Anew^^^Return to Turak Runetotem on the Elder Rise
column2: Thunder Bluff.^You've learned what it means to cure poison without the benefit of spiritual aid. Remember what others must endure in fighting poisonous afflictions as you soon embrace your newfound power over poison. You should now return to Turak Runetotem in Thunder Bluff
column3: <name>. He
column4: no doubt
column5: has a very important spell to teach you now that the student understands the lesson given unto <him /her>. Farewell
column6: young druid. We shall speak again.

column1: Get Me Out of Here!^39^All^Desolace^Melizza Brimbuzzle^Hornizz Brimbuzzle^^^^Escort Melizza Brimbuzzle
column2: then speak with Hornizz Brimbuzzle at the Kodo Graveyard in Desolace.^Get me out of here! I came up to the Valley of Spears to talk to the Maraudines. I thought I could do a little business with them... but they don't want to talk! I think they want to eat me! Get me out of here and my brother Hornizz will pay you big! He's at our camp next to the kodo graveyard
column3: to the east. Let's hurry
column4: <name>. Not two minutes ago I heard some centaurs talking about getting wood for their cookpot...

column1: The Ranger Lord's Behest^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Nathanos Blightcaller^Nathanos Blightcaller^^^Duskwing
column2: Oh How I Hate Thee...^Travel to the northern borders of the Eastern Plaguelands and recover the Quel'Thalas Registry. The item is somewhere in the Quel'Lithien lodge.^The high elves of the Quel'Lithien lodge possesses something that belongs to me
column3: <class>: A document detailing my life as a mortal. Before you ask; no
column4: you most certainly are not privy to such information. Just do as I tell you
column5: worm: Recover the registry. And imbecile
column6: be sure to leave as much strife and grief as possible in your wake. Leave them suffering...

column1: Ghost-o-plasm Round Up^39^All^Desolace^Hornizz Brimbuzzle^Hornizz Brimbuzzle^^^^Bring 8 Ghost-o-plasms and the Crate of Ghost Magnets to Hornizz Brimbuzzle in Desolace.^There's a valley to the southeast
column2: the Valley of Bones
column3: haunted by Magram ghosts. Sounds scary
column4: doesn't it? Well think how scary it is to the Magram! If we captured ghost energy from that place
column5: I bet it'd be worth plenty to those centaurs. Here
column6: take this crate of ghost magnets. If you place one between the two big skeletons in the valley
column7: the Dead Goliaths
column8: then ghosts will wander to it. Distance yourself
column9: take out the ghosts and get their ghost-o-plasm--that's what we'll sell to the Magram.

column1: Duskwing
column2: Oh How I Hate Thee...^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Nathanos Blightcaller^Nathanos Blightcaller^^The Ranger Lord's Behest^Ramstein^Find Duskwing and slay him. From the corpse
column3: recover a Patch of Duskwing's Fur and return it to Nathanos Blightcaller.^Up until now
column4: you have completed the missions I have assigned; even if not in the most timely manner. I suppose you think that you are ready for a challenge. Yes... Yes
column5: imbecile
column6: perhaps you are ready for a more involved set of missions. The albino demon bat
column7: Duskwing
column8: roams the countryside just north of here. Track him down and destroy him. Return to me with a patch of his white fur and you shall be rewarded.

column1: The Corpulent One^60^Horde^Eastern Plaguelands^Nathanos Blightcaller^Nathanos Blightcaller^^^^Find Borelgore in the northern wastes of Eastern Plaguelands and destroy him. Return to Nathanos Blightcaller when the mission is complete.^Past the Argent Dawn encampment of Light's Hope and west of Northdale
column2: you will find the corpulent maggot beast
column3: Borelgore. I've lost entire regiments to that monster. His size knows no bounds! The more he eats the greater his girth becomes... While I would not suffer any emotional harm should the beast devour you
column4: I would prefer that you were the victor. Borelgore has been known to devour others who tried to hunt him.

column1: Brother Anton^39^Alliance^Desolace^Brother Crowley^Brother Anton^Brother Anton^^^Speak with Brother Anton at Nijel's Point in Desolace.^My brother in arms
column2: Brother Anton
column3: heard rumors of an undead infestation in distant Kalimdor
column4: in a land known as Desolace. Anton immediately booked passage to that place
column5: to seek and destroy the undead menace! He is looking for those with the bravery and resolve to aid him. If your heart is true
column6: then speak with Anton. He is in Desolace
column7: in the Alliance town of Nijel's Point.

column1: Clam Bait^35^Horde^Desolace^Mai'Lahii^Mai'Lahii^^^^Find 10 pieces of Soft-shelled Clam Meat and bring it back to Mai'Lahii at Shadowprey Village.^You have the look of a fisherman
column2: <class>! I love to fish - been fishing all my life. The best bait to use is soft-shelled clam meat; the fish just can't resist
column3: you know what I mean? Up north you will find a wrecked ship off the coast. Soft-shelled clams are littered throughout the area. If you bring me back 10 pieces of soft-shelled clam meat
column4: I will give you something in return.

column1: Other Fish to Fry^36^Horde^Desolace^Drulzegar Skraghook^Drulzegar Skraghook^^^^Slay 7 Slitherblade Myrmidon
column2: 7 Slitherblade Naga
column3: and 5 Slitherblade Sorceresses
column4: and then talk to Drulzegar at Shadowprey in Desolace.^Maybe you heard or maybe you haven't... my crew and I was out fishing near Ranazjar Isle
column5: north of the wrecked ship off the coast up north. We used to fish there all the time; now all I do is think of a way to seek revenge for my fallen comrades. The naga attacked us one morning
column6: killing everyone except me. Me conscience can't handle the guilt
column7: <class>; I need you to go and fry them naga for me. I'll make the effort worth your while; you think you can help me with that?

column1: The Call to Command^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Nathanos Blightcaller^Bragor Bloodfist^The Call to Command^^The Crimson Courier^Travel to the Undercity and speak with Bragor Bloodfist.^The order has come down
column2: <class>. Bragor Bloodfist himself has requested that I send my most 'capable' agents back to the Undercity for a highly sensitive tactical operation. Unfortunately
column3: my most capable agents were killed over three years ago. In their stead I have a collection of brain dead riff-raff. <Nathanos stares coldly at you.> Travel to the Undercity at once and report to Bragor Bloodfist. Do not embarrass me
column4: <class>!

column1: The Crimson Courier^60^Horde^Eastern Plaguelands^Varimathras^Nathanos Blightcaller^The Call to Command^^^Return to Eastern Plaguelands and track down the Crimson Courier. Kill the Courier and recover the Grand Crusader's Command.^Just as the body cannot survive without the head
column2: the head cannot survive without the body. The defenses of the Scarlet Crusade's command inside Stratholme are almost impenetrable. We must
column3: instead
column4: cut the body out from under the head. My Deathstalkers have been collecting data on the activity of the Crusade outside of Stratholme. Each day
column5: a report is sent from their central command to Tyr's Hand. This report is the key
column6: <race>! Find the Crimson Courier and recover that report. Return it to Nathanos.

column1: Nathanos' Ruse^60^Horde^Eastern Plaguelands^Nathanos Blightcaller^Crusader Lord Valdelmar^The Call to Command^^^Travel to Tyr's Hand
column2: southeast of the Marris Stead. Once there
column3: take a bite of the Rotten Apple. While under the guise of the Scarlet Crusade
column4: deliver the Grand Crusader's Command to Crusader Lord Valdelmar.^I have made some adjustments to this command. Should our little ruse work
column5: they will expose the Scarlet Oracle and we shall strike! Now pay attention
column6: <class>. You are to deliver this command to the Crusader Lord
column7: Valdelmar. How? You are going to hand it to him
column8: imbecile. Take the command and this rotten apple to Tyr's Hand. When you cross into the city
column9: eat the apple. You will transform into something more... palatable to the humans. Take the command and hand it to the Crusader Lord
column10: Valdelmar.

column1: Return to Nathanos^60^Horde^Eastern Plaguelands^Crusader Lord Valdelmar^Nathanos Blightcaller^The Call to Command^^^Return to Nathanos Blightcaller with the new information.^The Grand Crusader makes an unusual request. Hrm
column2: regardless... what he asks will be done. Return to the Scarlet Bastion and notify him that the Oracle will be en route shortly. We will take every precaution to ensure that she makes it to Stratholme unharmed.

column1: The Scarlet Oracle
column2: Demetria^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Nathanos Blightcaller^Nathanos Blightcaller^The Call to Command^^^The Scarlet Crusade is on the move. Somewhere along the road from Tyr's Hand to Stratholme you will find the Oracle
column3: Demetria
column4: and her entourage. Hunt her down and slay her. Return to Nathanos Blightcaller should you succeed.^Demetria is chief advisor to the Grand Crusader. She is called the Oracle due to her 'otherworldly' senses. She has successfully assisted the Crusade in several of their victories against the Scourge. While this ruse was successful in exposing her
column5: if she truly does possess psychic powers
column6: she will undoubtedly be expecting some sort of trouble. You are going to provide that 'trouble.' Track down the Oracle and terminate her. They should be moving out of Tyr's Hand as we speak. Make me proud
column7: worm.

column1: Claim Rackmore's Treasure!^36^All^Desolace^Rackmore's Log^Rackmore's Chest^^^^Find Rackmore's Silver Key. Find Rackmore's Golden Key. Find and open Rackmore's Chest.^Rackmore's log tells of how his ship was sailing for Feathermoon Stronghold when it was attacked by seafaring creatures. To prevent his treasure from falling into enemy hands
column2: he hid his chest on Ranazjar Isle. To open the chest requires two keys
column3: a silver and a gold. These keys were lost
column4: but if the keys and the chest are found
column5: a treasure awaits!

column1: A Husband's Last Battle^51^Horde^Felwood^Dreka'Sur^Dreka'Sur^^^^Kill Overlord Ror and return his claw to Dreka'Sur at Bloodvenom Post in Felwood.^My husband traveled Felwood for the honor of our clan
column2: doing battle against the Shadow Council and other corrupt atrocities! After he escaped death numerous times
column3: I received a letter from him saying that a druid asked him for help against a great befouled furbolg named Overlord Ror--the two were never heard from again. I want this Ror's clawed hand
column4: <name>. I want it to pay for leaving me a widow! I believe the creature is to the south... near the Ashenvale border.

column1: Ramstein^60^Horde^Stratholme^Nathanos Blightcaller^Nathanos Blightcaller^^Duskwing
column2: Oh How I Hate Thee...^^Travel to Stratholme and slay Ramstein the Gorger. Take his head as a souvenir for Nathanos.^I was overwhelmed. On this very stead
column3: I stood... held my ground in defense of Lordaeron. The farm and all on it were waylaid by a gigantic wave of Scourge. The wretch. The filth. It hovered above me
column4: entrails hanging from its gaping chest cavity. I woke as Scourge. For so long I was helpless. My mind had coalesced with the Lich King's. She came for me... somewhere
column5: somehow
column6: I knew she would. Free. And now
column7: I must have my vengeance - my vengeance on that which took from me my life. Destroy it.

column1: Augustus' Receipt Book^55^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Augustus the Touched^Augustus the Touched^^^^Get Augustus' Receipt Book from the inn in Terrordale.^I'm ready for business! What you do want? Oh wait... I can't open up shop without my receipt book. How am I to keep track of things without my receipt book? I must have left it in town somewhere. I had a room in the inn... the book must be there. Bring me my book. Please
column2: bring it to me! Bring me my book and you'll see! I'll set up shop and you'll see that my prices are INSANE!

column1: A Swift Message^10^Human^Westfall^Quartermaster Lewis^Thor^A Swift Message^^^Bring Lewis' Note to Thor the gryphon master.^Although we don't get much aid from Stormwind directly
column2: I do have a contact in the city who helps supply us with armor. His name is Osric Strang. His shop
column3: Limited Immunity
column4: is in the Old Town of Stormwind. Our supply of armor dwindles
column5: and I must contact Osric for more. Can you take him this note? The fastest way to Stormwind is through Thor
column6: our gryphon master. He's just down the hill; bring him my note
column7: and then take a gryphon to Stormwind.

column1: The First and the Last^60^Alliance^Stormwind City^Highlord Bolvar Fordragon^Master Mathias Shaw^The First and the Last^^^Speak with Mathias Shaw in Old Town Stormwind. He resides in the Barracks.^Nathanos Marris was the first and last of the human ranger lords. A disciple of Sylvanas Windrunner
column2: now the Banshee Queen of the Forsaken. We had thought that Nathanos had been killed in action in the defense of Lordaeron five years ago. Although his corpse was never recovered
column3: it was assumed that he did not make it out of the Eastern Plaguelands. Mathias Shaw has been investigating the disappearance and may have some new information. Report to him at once. He resides in Old Town
column4: at the Barracks.

column1: Honor the Dead^60^Alliance^Stormwind City^Master Mathias Shaw^Master Mathias Shaw^The First and the Last^^^Speak with Mathias Shaw again if you wish to accept his task.^Five of my best field agents were assigned the Marris case. One returned
column2: only to end up dead in his sleep three days later. What little information we did manage to get out of him was incoherent gibberish. We made out two words: "Nathanos
column3: and Blightcaller." I do not have the available manpower to continue this investigation and Ravenholdt will not assist us. We must get to the bottom of this; if only to provide closure to the families of the deceased. Will you help?

column1: Flint Shadowmore^60^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Master Mathias Shaw^Flint Shadowmore^The First and the Last^^^Travel to Chillwind Camp in the Western Plaguelands and meet up with your contact
column2: Flint Shadowmore.^The only information we have thus far
column3: then
column4: is that Nathanos Marris may have been slain by this Blightcaller. We assume the Blightcaller is the same fiend that disposed of my agents. Flint Shadowmore
column5: another SI:7 operative
column6: is stationed at the Alliance encampment of Chillwind Point in the Western Plaguelands. Seek him out; he will debrief you on the current situation in the Plagues and give you an assignment. Good luck
column7: <name>.

column1: The Eastern Plagues^60^Alliance^Eastern Plaguelands^Flint Shadowmore^Flint Shadowmore^The First and the Last^^^Scour the Eastern Plaguelands for clues as to the "Blightcaller" and the missing SI:7 agents. If you find any SI:7 Insignias
column2: return them to Flint Shadowmore at Chillwind Camp.^As I said
column3: your first mission is one of reconnaissance. Nothing fancy
column4: <name>. You must travel to the Eastern Plaguelands and look for any clues as to this Blightcaller. Be on the lookout for information about our missing operatives. We have to assume that they are dead and if they are dead
column5: they must have a corpse... somewhere. <Flint swallows hard.> All SI:7 agents carry this insignia. <Flint shows you his SI:7 insignia.> Bring any of those that you may find back to me.

column1: The Blightcaller Cometh^60^Alliance^Stormwind City^Flint Shadowmore^King Varian Wrynn^The First and the Last^^^Return to Stormwind and inform King Varian Wrynn of the fate of Nathanos Marris.^<The blood appears to have completely drained from Flint's face.> Na... Nathanos did this? Nathanos is the Blightcaller? Why? He was... was so noble - a ranger lord respected by all. The only human ever allowed to train under the high elves. Now a ruthless agent of the Forsaken? I... I am sorry to ask this of you
column2: <name>
column3: but King Wrynn must be informed of this turn of events at once. Please
column4: return to Stormwind and deliver the news.

column1: Order Must Be Restored^60^Alliance^Eastern Plaguelands^King Varian Wrynn^King Varian Wrynn^The First and the Last^^^Assemble an army and travel to the Eastern Plaguelands. Launch a full assault on Nathanos Blightcaller and any Horde filth that may attempt to protect him.^Do you know how many ranger lords exist in this world? How many human ranger lords have ever existed? Nathanos' accomplishments were unprecedented. He was a tactical genius
column2: responsible for Alliance victories spanning a decade of conflict. And now... the champion of the Forsaken. No. This cannot be. Order must be restored. Gather an army
column3: <name>. Return to the Plagues with your army and destroy the Blightcaller. I wish you luck
column4: <name>. Truly
column5: you will need it for this battle.

column1: Dungar Longdrink^10^Human^Westfall^Osric Strang^Dungar Longdrink^A Swift Message^^^Bring Osric's Crate to Dungar Longdrink the gryphon master.^<name>
column2: I gathered into this crate everything Lewis asked for. Can you take it to him? If you've already spoken to Thor in Westfall
column3: then you can take a gryphon back to him. Dungar Longdrink is our gryphon master
column4: over in the trade district. Speak with Dungar
column5: then get this crate to Lewis as fast as you can. We don't want our fighting men and women in Westfall to go without fresh equipment!

column1: Continue to Stormwind^10^Human^Westfall^Thor^Osric Strang^A Swift Message^^^Buy a gryphon ride from the gryphon master Thor
column2: then bring Lewis' Note to Osric Strang
column3: in the shop Limited Immunity
column4: in the Old Town of Stormwind.^For a small fee
column5: you can take a gryphon to Stormwind
column6: so you can deliver Lewis' note to Osric. You won't get there faster any other way. If that sounds acceptable
column7: then just speak to me again when you're ready for the ride. I'll charge you a little
column8: but trust me; it'll be worth it!

column1: Harpies Threaten^26^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Maggran Earthbinder^Maggran Earthbinder^Harpies Threaten^^^Maggran Earthbinder in Sun Rock Retreat wants you to slay 7 Bloodfury Harpies
column2: 7 Bloodfury Ambushers
column3: 7 Bloodfury Slayers and 7 Bloodfury Roguefeathers.^Tauren take pride as the protector of these lands. Undoubtedly you can guess why I am alarmed with the number of harpies that dwell here in Stonetalon. The Bloodfuries are the source of the increasing number of harpies in Kalimdor; they encroach upon all likes of life preventing the innocent from leaving their boundaries. I need you to cull the harpies
column4: <name>!

column1: Bloodfury Bloodline^26^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Maggran Earthbinder^Maggran Earthbinder^Harpies Threaten^^^Maggran at Sun Rock Retreat wishes you to slay Bloodfury Ripper and bring her remains as proof of your deed.^Limiting the number of Bloodfury Harpies will not be enough. The only true cure for their disease would be to slay their leader
column2: Bloodfury Ripper! She is all but a queen to those filthy creatures. Slay her and their numbers will surely diminish. Go back into the Charred Vale and you will find her along the western hills. She will not be easy to vanquish
column3: but the reward will be great.

column1: Arachnophobia^21^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Wanted Poster: Besseleth^Maggran Earthbinder^^^^Kill Besseleth and bring Besseleth's Fang to Maggran at Sun Rock Retreat.^Warning: Proceed into Sishir Canyon west of here at your own risk. Besseleth and her eight-legged children of the forest have claimed this canyon as their webbed lair. Maggran Earthbinder in Sun Rock Retreat has placed a bounty on Besseleth. Slay her and bring proof of your killing to Maggran; there you will receive your reward for disposing this eight-legged menace.
Return to Lewis^10^Human^Westfall^Dungar Longdrink^Quartermaster Lewis^A Swift Message^^^Buy a gryphon ride to Sentinel Hill from the gryphon master Dungar Longdrink
column2: then take Osric's Crate to Lewis at Sentinel Hill.^The gryphon master in Westfall is Thor. If you've spoken to him before
column3: then you can take one of my gryphons to him. That's a good lesson to know: gryphons are always trained to fly to their capital city
column4: but they'll only take you to a remote gryphon master after you've already been there. You've already been to Thor
column5: so just speak with me again when you're ready to take a gryphon to Westfall. Once there
column6: you can deliver Osric's Crate to Quartermaster Lewis.

column1: Cycle of Rebirth^23^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Tammra Windfield^Tammra Windfield^^^New Life^Tammra Windfield at Sun Rock Retreat wants you to gather 10 Gaea Seeds.^Industrial greed and continuous war have wrecked the lands of Stonetalon. Only the blessings of the Earthmother can cure such injury. <name>
column2: I will require you to seek a special seed
column3: the Gaea seed. They are only found here in Stonetalon Mountain
column4: north of Sun Rock Retreat at Mirkfallon Lake
column5: near the water's edge. Once you bring me the seeds I will imbue them with shamanistic power to speed their growth.

column1: Supplying the Sepulcher^10^Undead^Silverpine Forest^Deathguard Podrig^Karos Razok^Supplying the Sepulcher^^^Bring Podrig's Order to Karos Razok.^Executor Hadrec asked me to take stock of our equipment at the Sepulcher. With the Scourge
column2: and worse
column3: lurking in the woods
column4: he doesn't want the Deathguards to lack gear they might need. I found that we are
column5: in general
column6: well stocked
column7: but we do need more weapons to replace those lost in the field. Here is a requisition order of what is needed
column8: for the weapon dealer Gordon Wendham in the Undercity. Take the order to our bat master
column9: Karos Razok
column10: and speak with him about transport to the Undercity.

column1: Michael Garrett^10^Undead^Silverpine Forest^Gordon Wendham^Michael Garrett^Supplying the Sepulcher^^^Bring Gordon's Crate to Michael Garrett.^I have placed the Sepulcher's supplies into this crate. If you have already visited the Sepulcher and spoken with their bat master
column2: then you may ride a bat back to him. Speak with the Undercity's bat master
column3: Michael Garrett. He can provide you with a bat to the Sepulcher.

column1: Ride to the Undercity^10^Undead^Silverpine Forest^Karos Razok^Gordon Wendham^Supplying the Sepulcher^^^Buy a bat ride to the Undercity from the bat master Karos Razok
column2: then take Podrig's Order to Gordon Wendham in the Undercity.^One of my bats can take you to the Undercity
column3: for a small fee. Speak with me again when you are ready so that we may arrange your transport. You will find Gordon Wendham in the Trade Quarter of the Undercity. That is the same quarter where my bat will land.

column1: Return to Podrig^10^Undead^Silverpine Forest^Michael Garrett^Deathguard Podrig^Supplying the Sepulcher^^^Buy a bat ride to the Sepulcher from the bat master Michael Garrett
column2: then bring Gordon's Crate to Deathguard Podrig in the Sepulcher.^The bat master in the Sepulcher is Karos Razok. If you have already met him
column3: then I can give you a bat to fly back to him. Our bats will always fly to the Undercity
column4: but to travel to more remote locales their rider must first visit the area and speak with its bat master. You have met Karos in the Sepulcher
column5: so you may now fly bats there. Speak with me again when you are ready.

column1: The Bounty of Teldrassil^10^Night Elf^Darkshore^Nessa Shadowsong^Vesprystus^Nessa Shadowsong^^^Bring Nessa's Collection to Vesprystus.^The fishermen of Rut'theran village do very well
column2: for the fish here are extremely large and abundant. I would like to compare the bounty here with that of the mainland. I have a collection of fish bones and scales that I would like taken to a colleague of mine in Darkshore. His name is Laird
column3: he is a fish vendor in the village of Auberdine. Bring my collection to our hippogryph master
column4: Vesprystus
column5: and speak to him about traveling to Auberdine.

column1: Flight to Auberdine^10^Night Elf^Darkshore^Vesprystus^Laird^Nessa Shadowsong^^^Ride a hippogryph to Auberdine from the hippogryph master Vesprystus
column2: then bring Nessa's Collection to Laird.^From Rut'theran
column3: there are two methods of travel to Auberdine: by ferry and by hippogryph. Both are quick and reliable
column4: but if you have not yet flown to Auberdine by hippogryph
column5: then I suggest you do. It is sound advice to speak with the hippogryph master in every town that has one. Once you speak to the master
column6: you can then fly there from other towns. Here is Nessa's collection. Speak with me again when you are ready to fly to Auberdine and deliver Nessa's collection to Laird.

column1: Return to Nessa^10^Night Elf^Darkshore^Laird^Nessa Shadowsong^Nessa Shadowsong^^^Bring Laird's Response to Nessa Shadowsong.^I must send a response to Nessa. She'll be very interested to know how different the fish here are from those along Teldrassil's coastline. We can only guess the cause
column2: but it is my suspicion that the world tree itself is affecting the wildlife around it! Please
column3: take this response to Nessa. If you wish to take a hippogryph back to Rut'theran then speak with the hippogryph master Caylais Moonfeather. If you wish to take the ferry
column4: then one regularly departs from the dock to the northwest.

column1: Nessa Shadowsong^10^Night Elf^Darnassus^Mydrannul^Nessa Shadowsong^Nessa Shadowsong^^^Speak with Nessa Shadowsong.^A friend of mine
column2: Nessa Shadowsong
column3: is a fishing merchant in Rut'theran Village. She needs a parcel taken to Darkshore
column4: and is looking for someone to help her. If you're interested
column5: then to reach Nessa you must take the portal in Darnassus to Rut'theran Village. You will find the portal west of the Temple Gardens.

column1: A Bundle of Hides^10^Tauren^The Barrens^Jahan Hawkwing^Devrak^A Bundle of Hides^^^Bring the Bundle of Hides to the wind rider master Devrak in the Crossroads.^I have a bundle of hides from the animals of the Barrens
column2: and must get them to Thunder Bluff. A colleague there
column3: Ahanu
column4: will use the hides to create leather goods. Will you take the hides to him for me? The quickest way to Thunder Bluff is on the back of a wind rider. Bring the bundle of hides to Devrak
column5: our wind rider master in the Crossroads
column6: and speak to him about transport to Thunder Bluff.

column1: Ride to Thunder Bluff^10^Tauren^The Barrens^Devrak^Ahanu^A Bundle of Hides^^^Buy a wind rider to Thunder Bluff from the wind rider master Devrak
column2: then bring the Bundle of Hides to Ahanu in Thunder Bluff.^For a small fee
column3: I will give you a wind rider to Thunder Bluff. There's no faster way to the city! If that is acceptable
column4: speak to me again when you are ready to go. If you're taking those hides to Ahanu
column5: then I think he's at Hewa's Armory
column6: at the base of the wind rider tower in Thunder Bluff. And that's right where you'll land!

column1: Tal the Wind Rider Master^10^Tauren^The Barrens^Ahanu^Tal^A Bundle of Hides^^^Bring Ahanu's Leather Goods to Tal in Thunder Bluff.^I have prepared leather goods for Jahan to sell at the Crossroads. Will you bring them to him? If you have already been to the Crossroads and spoken to their wind rider master
column2: then you can fly one of our Thunder Bluff wind riders back to him. Take the leather goods to Tal
column3: our wind rider master in Thunder Bluff
column4: and speak with him to arrange transport to the Crossroads.

column1: Return to Jahan^10^Tauren^The Barrens^Tal^Jahan Hawkwing^A Bundle of Hides^^^Buy a wind rider to the Crossroads from the wind rider master Tal
column2: then bring Ahanu's Leather Goods to Jahan Hawkwing.^In order to fly to a town
column3: you must have already been there and spoken with the wind rider master of that town. You have been to the Crossroads and spoken to their wind rider master Devrak
column4: so for a small fee you can take a wind rider to him from here. Speak with me again when you are ready. Once at the Crossroads
column5: you can then deliver the leather goods to Jahan Hawkwing.

column1: Meats to Orgrimmar^10^Orc
column2: Troll^The Barrens^Zargh^Devrak^Meats to Orgrimmar^^^Bring Zargh's Meats to Devrak in the Crossroads.^I have some choice cuts of meat that I want to send to a friend. Her name is Gryshka
column3: the innkeeper in Orgrimmar. Will you deliver the meat for me? The fastest way to Orgrimmar is on a wind rider. Take the meats to the Crossroads wind rider master
column4: Devrak
column5: and speak with him about transport to Orgrimmar.

column1: New Life^25^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Tammra Windfield^Tammra Windfield^^Cycle of Rebirth^^Plant 10 Gaea Seeds in Gaea Dirt Mounds
column2: and then return the remaining Enchanted Gaea Seeds to Tammra at Sun Rock Retreat.^As you have seen
column3: <class>
column4: though the land is in pain
column5: the cycle of life is a powerful thing. Now we must do our part help it along. You must plant these seeds at the center of the destruction
column6: to the west
column7: in the Charred Vale. Beware
column8: for harpies and angry fire elementals still plague the scarred land. <name>
column9: take these enchanted Gaea seeds and plant them in fertile mounds of soil. The cycle of life must go on!

column1: The Ashenvale Hunt^20^Horde^The Barrens^Jorn Skyseer^Senani Thunderheart^^Ishamuhale^^Speak with Senani Thunderheart at Splintertree Post
column2: Ashenvale.^Your strength impresses me
column3: <class>. Your willingness to embrace the hunt gives me confidence that you could move on to bigger game... and bigger challenges. The forests of Ashenvale represent a vast untamed wild that the Horde seeks to impose its own will upon
column4: both politically and spiritually. If you seek to prove yourself in an unproven land
column5: seek the guidance of Senani Thunderheart in Splintertree Post. The outpost is due north of the path leading from the Barrens.

column1: Ride to Orgrimmar^10^Orc
column2: Troll^The Barrens^Devrak^Innkeeper Gryshka^Meats to Orgrimmar^^^Buy a wind rider to Orgrimmar from the wind rider master Devrak
column3: then bring Zargh's Meats to Gryshka in Orgrimmar.^For just a few coins I will have a wind rider bring you to Orgrimmar. When you get there
column4: you can take Zargh's Meats to Gryshka. Her inn is in the Valley of Strength
column5: not far from the Skytower
column6: where my wind rider will drop you off. Speak with me again when you are ready for the journey.

column1: Doras the Wind Rider Master^10^Orc
column2: Troll^The Barrens^Innkeeper Gryshka^Doras^Meats to Orgrimmar^^^Bring Gryshka's Letter to Doras in Orgrimmar.^I've written a letter of thanks to Zargh. Will you deliver it for me? If you've already been to the Crossroads and spoken with their wind rider master
column3: then you can fly a wind rider back there. Take my letter to Doras
column4: the wind rider master of Orgrimmar
column5: and speak with him about transport to the Crossroads.

column1: Return to the Crossroads.^10^Orc
column2: Troll^The Barrens^Doras^Zargh^Meats to Orgrimmar^^^Buy a wind rider to the Crossroads from the wind rider master Doras
column3: then bring Gryshka's Letter to Zargh at the Crossroads.^My wind riders are trained to fly to many different places
column4: as long as you have already been to that place and spoken with the wind rider master there. You have been to the Crossroads and spoken to their wind rider master Devrak
column5: so now you can fly directly to him from here. Once you're at the Crossroads
column6: you can deliver Gryshka's letter to Zargh. Speak with me when you are ready to go.

column1: Honor Students^10^Dwarf
column2: Gnome^Loch Modan^Brock Stoneseeker^Thorgrum Borrelson^Honor Students^^^Bring Brock's List to Thorgrum Borrelson in Thelsamar.^I see a lot of young dwarves at my door
column3: eager to learn the trade of mining. And if there's one thing a miner needs more than anything
column4: it's a pick! I have a list of mining students who scored high in their lessons and earned an honorary pick. Take my list to Golnir Bouldertoe in Ironforge. He'll get the picks ready. The fastest way to Ironforge is on a gryphon
column5: so bring the list to our gryphon master
column6: Thorgrum Borrelson
column7: and speak with him about transport to Ironforge.

column1: Gryth Thurden^10^Dwarf
column2: Gnome^Loch Modan^Golnir Bouldertoe^Gryth Thurden^Honor Students^^^Bring the Honorary Picks to Gryth Thurden in Ironforge.^Here are the honorary picks for Brock's students. If you've already been to Thelsamar
column3: then you should fly a gryphon back there! Take the picks to our gryphon master
column4: Gryth Thurden
column5: and speak with him about a ride back to Thelsamar.

column1: A Plague Upon Thee^55^Alliance^Western Plaguelands^Termite Barrel^Nathaniel Dumah^A Plague Upon Thee^^^Release the Plagueland Termites in the Northridge Lumber Mill
column2: then return with the Barrel of Plagueland Termites to Nathaniel Dumah at Chillwind Camp in Western Plaguelands.^You look around the lumber mill for something suitable to open the barrel with. You find a crowbar that looks like it will do the trick. You set your feet and pray that you'll be able to get out of the mill before the termites get to you.

column1: A Plague Upon Thee^55^Horde^Western Plaguelands^Termite Barrel^Mickey Levine^A Plague Upon Thee^^^Release the Plagueland Termites in the Northridge Lumber Mill
column2: then return with the Barrel of Plagueland Termites to Mickey Levine at the Bulwark in Tirisfal Glades.^You look around the lumber mill for something suitable to open the barrel with. You find a crowbar that looks like it will do the trick. You set your feet and pray that you'll be able to get out of the mill before the termites get to you.

column1: Ride to Ironforge^10^Dwarf
column2: Gnome^Loch Modan^Thorgrum Borrelson^Golnir Bouldertoe^Honor Students^^^Buy a gryphon to Ironforge from the gryphon master Thorgrum Borrelson
column3: then bring Brock's List to Golnir Bouldertoe in Ironforge.^For just a few coins
column4: one of my gryphons will take you to Ironforge. From there
column5: deliver Brock's list to Golnir Bouldertoe. You'll find him in the Deep Mountain Mining Guild. That's in the Great Forge District of Ironforge
column6: which is right where my gryphon will drop you off! Speak to me again when you're ready for the journey.

column1: Return to Brock^10^Dwarf
column2: Gnome^Loch Modan^Gryth Thurden^Brock Stoneseeker^Honor Students^^^Buy a gryphon to Thelsamar from the gryphon master Gryth Thurden
column3: then bring the Honorary Picks to Brock Stoneseeker in Thelsamar.^For a small fee you can buy a gryphon ride to Thelsamar... as long as you've already been there. Gryphons will only fly you to places you've already been
column4: so be sure to speak with every gryphon master you see so you can fly to him later. You've already been to Thorgrum
column5: the gryphon master of Thelsamar
column6: so now you can return to him. And once in Thelsamar
column7: you can deliver the picks to Brock Stoneseeker. Speak with me when you're ready to go.

column1: Elemental War^25^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Tsunaman^Tsunaman^^^^Bring 10 Incendrites to Tsunaman at Sun Rock Retreat.^The Tribunal of the Tides has sent me to wage war on the fire elementals here in Stonetalon Mountain. Neptulon the Tidehunter
column2: Lord of all water elementals
column3: has taken a personal interest in seeing our fiery cousins extinguished. <name>
column4: you can help me gain favor with the Tribunal by destroying the fire elementals in Charred Vale. When destroyed
column5: the fire elementals leave Incendrites. Return these to me and be rewarded.

column1: Thazz'ril's Pick^4^All^Durotar^Foreman Thazz'ril^Foreman Thazz'ril^^Lazy Peons^^Bring Thazz'ril's Pick to Foreman Thazz'ril.^<name>
column2: you are a dependable <race>. Can I count on you for another task? Some time ago I was surveying the cave to the north for minerals
column3: and I left my favorite pick behind. When I later returned to retrieve it I found the cave was filled with vicious beasts! Will you go into the cave
column4: the Burning Blade Coven
column5: and get my pick? I left it in a chamber with waterfalls. My pick has a spell on it so you can see it in the dark
column6: so you won't have to worry about finding it... just what's guarding it!

column1: Marla's Last Wish^5^Horde^Tirisfal Glades^Novice Elreth^Novice Elreth^^The Damned^^Bring Samuel Fipps' Remains to Marla's Grave
column2: then return to Novice Elreth.^My friend Marla Fipps lived with her husband Samuel before the plague
column3: but when the plague came Samuel succumbed and joined the Scourge's ranks. Marla was spared an undeath only to die at the hands of her now mindless husband. So strong was her love
column4: however
column5: that her last dying wish was to be buried with her beloved Samuel. Samuel Fipps roams at a ruined camp along the road northeast of Deathknell. Defeat him and grant Marla's wish: bury him at her grave
column6: in the first row of our graveyard.

column1: Kaya's Alive^18^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Makaba Flathoof^Tammra Windfield^Protect Kaya^^^Tell Tammra Windfield in Sun Rock Retreat the good news.^Tell Tammra Windfield
column2: Kaya's aunt who's at Sun Rock Retreat
column3: about the good news! Kaya is alive! We had thought she was lost after the brutal attack on our village. Follow the path to the west to get to Sun Rock Retreat.

column1: Boulderslide Ravine^18^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Mor'rogal^Mor'rogal^^^Earthen Arise^Explore deep into the cave at Boulderslide Ravine and bring back 10 Resonite Crystals for Mor'rogal at Sun Rock Retreat to investigate.^Something is amiss here in Stonetalon. Can you feel the tension in the air
column2: <name>? Southeast of here lies a deep cave in Boulderslide Ravine. The kobolds there are frantically mining a rare crystal called Resonite. I need you to bring back some ore samples so that I can understand what's happening in that cave. I also need you to investigate the depth of that cave. Go young <class>
column3: it's imperative I know what evil lurks under these mountains.

column1: Satyr Horns^26^Horde^Ashenvale^Pixel^Pixel^^^^Collect 16 Satyr Horns for Pixel in Splintertree Post.^Heya! I've been traveling through Ashenvale
column2: heading towards Ratchet
column3: and decided to make a stop here at Splintertree. I'm always looking for an opportunity
column4: and it seems that satyr horns are in high demand in Ratchet these days. After asking around here
column5: it seems that the satyrs in Night Run
column6: Satyrnaar
column7: and Xavian all have the type of horns I am looking for. I'm no match for those satyrs... but you look like you might be! Tell you what
column8: you collect the horns for me and I'll make it worth your time.

column1: Naga at the Zoram Strand^19^Horde^Ashenvale^Marukai^Marukai^^^^Bring 20 Wrathtail Heads to Marukai along the Zoram Strand.^There is evil lurking here along the coast
column2: <race>. It is the resting place of the doomed city of Zoram
column3: long destroyed and submerged beneath the seas. Lost
column4: and nearly forgotten. Now
column5: the naga have returned
column6: and for what reason we do not know. But reason matters little; we must defend the land we have worked so hard to claim as our own. Return to me with 20 of their heads! Throw the naga back to the depths!

column1: Blood Feeders^19^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Xen'Zilla^Xen'Zilla^^^^Xen'zilla at Malaka'Jin needs you to kill 10 Deepmoss Creepers and 7 Deepmoss Venomspitters.^We Trolls here at Malaka'Jin have prospered from the land; Stonetalon Mountain offers great hunting for us to live on. Lately
column2: we have attracted the wrong dinner guests... the spiders in these mountains have been raiding our camps at night looking to steal our hunt. If you were to help us kill off these ghastly beasts we at Malaka'Jin would be in your debt. Spiders are everywhere in Stonetalon - just head north from here and you will see what I am talking about.

column1: Troll Charm^24^Horde^Ashenvale^Mitsuwa^Mitsuwa^^^^Bring 8 Troll Charms to Mitsuwa at the Zoram'gar Outpost.^My kinfolk were traveling here with many sacred troll charms
column2: but the Thistlefur furbolgs attacked and killed them before they reached Zoram'gar! Those vile Furbolgs! I miss my brothers and sisters who were killed
column3: but we will meet again in the afterlife. However
column4: their troll charms hold great value in this world. It is an outrage that the furbolgs have them! <name>
column5: you must retrieve the charms! They are in chests in Thistlefur Hold
column6: a cave at the end of Thistlefur Village
column7: north of Astranaar.

column1: Earthen Arise^20^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Mor'rogal^Mor'rogal^^Boulderslide Ravine^^Open the Resonite cask with the Enchanted Resonite Crystal
column2: and then slay Goggeroc. Return to Mor'rogal with the news and Enchanted Resonite Crystal.^You have uncovered a dark threat to the land
column3: <class>. The Resonite cask you have found in that cave houses a slumbering Earthen by the name of Goggeroc. I have changed the mixture of the Resonite crystals that you gathered with my shamanistic powers. Take the enchanted Resonite crystal and smash open the Resonite cask
column4: which houses the Earthen. When awakened
column5: Goggeroc will be weakened... Slay him
column6: <name>!

column1: Freedom to Ruul^24^Horde^Ashenvale^Ruul Snowhoof^Yama Snowhoof^^^^Escort Ruul
column2: then speak with Yama Snowhoof in Splintertree Post.^Eh? Who are you? <name>? You're no furbolg. They are cursed! They thought I was a bear and captured me
column3: and now they starve me! My strength is failing... Help me escape
column4: then speak with my sister Yama at the Splintertree Post to the east. <name>! I must escape!

column1: Ashenvale Outrunners^24^Horde^Ashenvale^Kuray'bin^Kuray'bin^^^^Kill 9 Ashenvale Outrunners
column2: then return to Kuray'bin at Splintertree Outpost.^We received reports that Ashenvale outrunners left Silverwing Outpost not long ago
column3: and now sneak near our territories in the forest. We don't want them gathering intelligence on our defenses! Sneak through the forests south of our post here and east of the Alliance outpost of Silverwing. Find and slay the outrunners
column4: then return to me.

column1: The Lost Pages^30^Horde^Ashenvale^Gurda Ragescar^Gurda Ragescar^^^^Find the 12 missing pages of the Shredder Operating Manual
column2: and put them together to form Chapters 1
column4: and 3. Return the pages to Gurda Ragescar near Splintertree Post.^I just picked up this shredder from Ratchet and I was on my way back to the Warsong Lumber Camp
column5: where I am supposed to be on duty. I was given a manual on how to operate the shredder
column6: but on the trip back
column7: a huge gust of wind blew it from my hands. The pages went everywhere
column8: and all I was left with was the cover. The pages could be just about anywhere by now
column9: I suppose... but I don't know how to use the shredder without them! Will you find them for me?

column1: An Unholy Alliance^36^Horde^Razorfen Downs^Varimathras^Varimathras^An Unholy Alliance^^^Bring Ambassador Malcin's Head to Bragor Bloodfist in the Undercity.^Malcin claims he is outside Razorfen Downs. This ambassador must be slain--his mission a failure in the eyes of the Lich King. His presence there does explain much of what we've discovered about the area--some of the quilboar have grown frightfully powerful while showing signs of the Plague in their own way. Truly that must be a sign of some sort of deal they've struck. Find Malcin and slay him
column2: <name>. Return to me after the deed is done.

column1: An Unholy Alliance^36^Horde^Razorfen Downs^Small Scroll^Varimathras^An Unholy Alliance^^^Take the Small Scroll to Bragor Bloodfist at the Royal Quarter in the Undercity.^My Lady
column2: You know very well what it is we are offering. The opportunity for you to take the Barrens and the lands beyond is a great one. We simply want your aid in return. By aid we mean nothing more than your giving us the freedom to take action in the area. Please
column3: allow us to discuss this further. We have great power and are willing to share with those wise enough to join us. I will remain outside Razorfen Downs for the time being. Best Regards
column4: Ambassador Malcin

column1: Protect Kaya^18^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Kaya Flathoof^Makaba Flathoof^Protect Kaya^^^Escort Kaya Flathoof to Camp Aparaje
column2: and then return to Makaba Flathoof near the southeastern edge of Stonetalon.^Thank you for rescuing me! We must leave quickly before they discover that I am free. Please escort me to Camp Aparaje. From there
column3: I know my way. My father
column4: Makaba Flathoof
column5: will be desperate to know that I am safe.

column1: Report to Kadrak^19^Horde^The Barrens^Thork^Kadrak^Report to Kadrak^^^Report to Kadrak at the watch tower in northern Barrens.^Have you ever been to Ashenvale
column2: to the north? The horde has recently set up an outpost on the Zoram Strand there
column3: and we can always use some new recruits to help defend our new fronts. If you think you are up to it
column4: see Kadrak in the northern Barrens
column5: at the watch tower. He is heading up the Ashenvale campaign and can give you further orders.

column1: Report to Kadrak^19^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Darn Talongrip^Kadrak^Report to Kadrak^^^Report to Kadrak at the watch tower in northern Barrens.^Have you ever been to Ashenvale
column2: to the north? The horde has recently set up an outpost on the Zoram Strand there
column3: and we can always use some new recruits to help defend our new fronts. If you think you are up to it
column4: see Kadrak in the northern Barrens
column5: at the watch tower. He is heading up the Ashenvale campaign and can give you further orders.

column1: The Warsong Reports^19^Horde^Ashenvale^Kadrak^Kadrak^Report to Kadrak^^^Open the Bundle of Reports. Take the Warsong Reports to the Warsong Scout
column2: Warsong Runner
column3: and Warsong Outrider. Bring back the updates they give you to Kadrak at the northern watch tower in the barrens.^I recently deployed a few scouts into Ashenvale and I need a runner to take them their orders
column4: and bring me back a report of what they have observed. Your first stop should be the Zoram'gar Outpost
column5: along the coast to the west
column6: at the Zoram Strand
column7: to locate the first runner. You also need to stop at Splintertree Post
column8: to the north
column9: and along the road to the east
column10: near Azshara. You will find a scout and an outrider there. Give them each a report
column11: and from them
column12: get an update on their findings.

column1: Torek's Assault^24^Horde^Ashenvale^Torek^Ertog Ragetusk^^^^Escort Torek on his attack against Silverwing Outpost and Duriel Moonfire
column2: then report to Ertog Ragetusk at Splintertree Post.^Hey! <class>! Come here! My raiders and I are about to attack the Silverwing Outpost to the west. Our target is its leader
column3: Duriel Moonfire. Scouts report the outpost is defended heavily with sentinels and warriors. The battle will be glorious! Do you want to share in the glory
column4: <name>
column5: and aid us? If so
column6: then when it's over you can report our success to my superior
column7: Ertog Ragetusk in Splintertree. What do you say. Are you with us?

column1: Avenge My Village^18^Horde^Stonetalon Mountains^Makaba Flathoof^Makaba Flathoof^Avenge My Village^^^Kill 8 Grimtotem Ruffians and 6 Grimtotem Mercenaries
column2: and then return to Makaba Flathoof near the southeastern edge of Stonetalon.^The Grimtotem Clan raided my village and killed most everyone. I killed all I could
column3: but barely escaped with my life. <name>
column4: all I wish now is that more of them are dead. You will find them just to the west of here.

column1: Blackfathom Villainy^27^Horde^Blackfathom Deeps^Argent Guard Thaelrid^Bashana Runetotem^^^^Bring the head of Twilight Lord Kelris to Bashana Runetotem in Thunder Bluff.^Strength has left me. Your help is needed! Long ago this site was a great temple of Elune. But misfortune led to ruin when the corruption of an Old God seeped up from beneath the earth and tainted the sacred Moon Well. Aku'Mai
column2: servant of the Old God
column3: rose from the waters. The Twilight's Hammer cultists have allied with the naga to occupy these grounds. The cultists
column4: led by Kelris
column5: sacrifice innocents to Aku'Mai for power. Slay Kelris and bring his head to Bashana in Thunder Bluff
column6: <name>
column7: please.

column1: Trouble in the Deeps^22^Horde^Blackfathom Deeps^Tsunaman^Je'neu Sancrea^Trouble in the Deeps^^^Speak to Je'neu Sancrea in Ashenvale.^Je'neu Sancrea is in need of aid. He is at the Zoram'gar Outpost in Ashenvale. The Night elf forest is to the north of the Stonetalon mountains. You can reach it by traveling through Windshear Crag or by heading north through Barrens. Zoram Strand is far to the west of the forest. Be careful
column2: <name>. There are forces there that will not take to your presence kindly.

column1: The Essence of Aku'Mai^22^Horde^Blackfathom Deeps^Je'neu Sancrea^Je'neu Sancrea^Trouble in the Deeps^^Amongst the Ruins^Bring 20 Sapphires of Aku'Mai to Je'neu Sancrea in Ashenvale.^Within the beginning tunnels of Blackfathom Deeps
column2: large sapphire clusters can be found along the cave walls. Recently it was noted that the naga were harvesting the crystals. Until it can be discerned why
column3: I sense we should stop the naga from succeeding. The crystals have great elemental power and if used inappropriately
column4: could make for a powerful arcane component. Will you help me
column5: <name>? Blackfathom Deeps can be found along Zoram Strand to the north of our outpost.

column1: Allegiance to the Old Gods^22^Horde^Blackfathom Deeps^Damp Note^Je'neu Sancrea^Allegiance to the Old Gods^^^Bring the Damp Note to Je'neu Sancrea at Zoram'gar Outpost in Ashenvale.^Some poor handwriting is scrawled on the crumpled up note: "Yes
column2: tell all the priestesses to bring the crystals to me. The water elemental spirits are strong within them and they will aid our aquamancers greatly in their own summonings. By controlling the power within the crystals
column3: we will appease Aku'Mai. One day we will have enough power to bring Aku'Mai back to us and the world will return to its greatest era! An era of rule by the Old Gods!"

column1: Allegiance to the Old Gods^26^Horde^Blackfathom Deeps^Je'neu Sancrea^Je'neu Sancrea^Allegiance to the Old Gods^^^Kill Lorgus Jett in Blackfathom Deeps and then return to Je'neu Sancrea in Ashenvale.^This Twilight's Hammer follower cannot be allowed to complete his plan. column5: flipflop! Don't ye get it? Ah

Just capture five of the little buggers and bring em back here. We needs em alive. Arrrrr...
