column5: so we are reluctant to send you on this last mission for we do not want to lose such a useful agent. But its success would further our war efforts tremendously and... it was deemed worth risking you. We want these captains in the Molten Core destroyed: Lucifron
column6: Sulfuron
column7: Gehennas and Shazzrah. Kill them and bring me their hands! This task will take every resource you possess
column8: <name>
column9: but if can do it then the Firelords will be dealt a terrible blow.

column1: Umber
column2: Archivist^57^All^Silithus^Layo Starstrike^Umber^The New Frontier^^^Take the Encrusted Silithid Object to Umber - the Cenarion Circle's archivist - in the village of Nighthaven
column3: Moonglade.^There's plenty to do here still
column4: but I think taking this back to the Circle for analysis is key. Trust me - the work will still be here once this is all said and done. If it's a journal inside this sticky chitin
column5: then the Circle would finally have a window into the past! Take this to the Circle's archivist in Nighthaven. His name is Umber
column6: and the man's brilliant. Touched
column7: sure
column8: but brilliant nonetheless! Umber's salvaged tomes in far worse shape than this. If it can be saved
column9: he can do it.

column1: Uncovering Past Secrets^57^All^Moonglade^Umber^Rabine Saturna^The New Frontier^^Under the Chitin Was...^Speak with Rabine Saturna in the village of Nighthaven
column2: Moonglade.^Anyway
column3: you should check back with me relatively soon... that is if you want to know what was in here. As soon as I find out what it is
column4: and if it's indeed a book
column5: I'd be happy to share that information with you. In the meantime
column6: I'd check in with the den mother of this little bear camp
column7: Rabine. No doubt he'll want to know what crazy antics you've been up to. Never leave the den mother waiting
column8: <name>... that is
column9: unless you want to be doused in honey. It's happened
column10: trust me.

column1: Zinfizzlex's Portable Shredder Unit^60^Horde^Alterac Valley^Master Engineer Zinfizzlex^Master Engineer Zinfizzlex^^^^Master Engineer Zinfizzlex wants you to bring him the following:^I'm as anxious as you are to try out my portable shredder unit
column2: <race>
column3: but before I can make the kit
column4: I'm going to need materials - lots of materials! To be exact
column5: I'm going to need a mountain of thorium
column6: mithril
column7: and iron. I will also need one steamsaw per unit. You'll have to get those at the lumber mill. When I was nosing around in here (before my capture) I noticed a pile of steamsaws at the Stormpike lumber camp.

column1: Zinfizzlex's Portable Shredder Unit^60^Alliance^Alterac Valley^Master Engineer Zinfizzlex^Master Engineer Zinfizzlex^^^^Master Engineer Zinfizzlex wants you to bring him the following:^I'm as anxious as you are to try out my portable shredder unit
column2: <race>
column3: but before I can make the kit
column4: I'm going to need materials - lots of materials! To be exact
column5: I'm going to need a mountain of thorium
column6: mithril
column7: and iron. I will also need one steamsaw per unit. You'll have to get those at the lumber mill. When I was nosing around in here (before my capture) I noticed a pile of steamsaws at the Frostwolf lumber camp.

column1: Amongst the Ruins^27^Horde^Blackfathom Deeps^Je'neu Sancrea^Je'neu Sancrea^^^^Bring the Fathom Core to Je'neu Sancrea at Zoram'gar Outpost
column2: Ashenvale.^The Twilight's Hammer has moved into the Moonshrine Ruins of Blackfathom Deeps. Their presence can only serve to coerce the elements into working against us. If left unchecked
column3: this region will be theirs for good. <name>
column4: go into Blackfathom and find the ruin's fathom stone; it should be somewhere close in the water. In it is a fathom core - a device that when properly read it will relate a history of all elemental activity. If I have it
column5: I and the Earthen Ring can maybe do something to stop them!

column1: Baron Aquanis^30^Horde^Ashenvale^Strange Water Globe^Je'neu Sancrea^^^^Bring the Strange Water Globe to Je'neu Sancrea at Zoram'gar Outpost
column2: Ashenvale.^The defeated water elemental has left behind a strange water globe. You surmise that the object somehow fed the beast energy. Inside the globe
column3: a putrid-looking form of water sloshes about. The globe itself seems impervious to any sort of physical force. If anyone can make any sense of this item
column4: it would be Je'neu Sancrea of the Earthen Ring. He is located at the Horde's Zoram'gar Outpost in Ashenvale.

column1: The Glowing Shard^26^All^Wailing Caverns^Glowing Shard^Falla Sagewind^^^In Nightmares
column2: In Nightmares^Travel to Ratchet to find someone that can tell you more about the glowing shard.^The shard is a brilliant green
column3: and although solid
column4: what looks like smoke swirls just below the surface. You can't help staring into the depths of the crystal; at the same time
column5: you know there is something very disturbing about it. Maybe you should see if anyone in Ratchet can tell you more about this strange shard.

column1: Coldtooth Supplies^51^Alliance^Alterac Valley^Stormpike Quartermaster^Stormpike Quartermaster^^^^Bring 10 Coldtooth Supplies to the Alliance Quartermaster in Dun Baldar.^The Coldtooth mine is a storage depot for the Horde. I can't stomach the food they give their troops
column2: and the state of their arms and armor is atrocious! But... in times like these when supplies are so important
column3: we can use what they have. Enter the Coldtooth mine and bring me back their supplies. That will help keep the Alliance in fighting shape
column4: and remove much needed equipment from the Horde's warriors. Good luck
column5: <name>. The mine is to the distant south
column6: deep in Horde territory.

column1: Irondeep Supplies^51^Horde^Alterac Valley^Frostwolf Quartermaster^Frostwolf Quartermaster^^^^Bring 10 Irondeep Supplies to the Horde Quartermaster in Frostwolf Keep.^The Stormpike dwarves are using the Irondeep mine as a storage depot. I want you to raid that mine and bring me its supplies. This will curtail the Stormpikes' efforts in Alterac Valley
column2: and will provide us with needed equipment! Be wary
column3: <name>. The Irondeep mine is deep in Alliance territory
column4: and control of the mine is as shifting as the snows of Alterac.

column1: Empty Stables^51^Horde^Alterac Valley^Frostwolf Stable Master^Frostwolf Stable Master^^^^Locate a Frostwolf in Alterac Valley. Use the Frostwolf Muzzle when you are near the Frostwolf to 'tame' the beast. Once tamed
column2: the Frostwolf will follow you back to the Frostwolf Stable Master. Speak with the Frostwolf Stable Master to earn credit for the capture.^The war in the valley has taken its toll on our soldiers. We must revitalize our forces! If we can fill up the stables
column3: the Wolf Riders will once more be able to ride out into the field of battle. Take this muzzle and track down the frostwolves that inhabit the nearby forest. Once you find a wolf
column4: use the muzzle to tame the beast. Bring the tamed beast back to me so that I may place it in the stable. When we have enough wolves stabled
column5: the Wolf Riders will rejoin their patrol on our front lines.

column1: Zapped Giants^48^All^Feralas^Zorbin Fandazzle^Zorbin Fandazzle^^^Again With the Zapped Giants^Use Zorbin's Ultra-Shrinker to zap any kind of giant found in Feralas into a more manageable form. Bring 15 Miniaturization Residues found on the zapped versions of these giants to Zorbin Fandazzle at the docks of the Forgotten Coast
column2: Feralas.^I'm going to have to do something about the giants if I stay out here! They're certainly not good for business
column3: now are they? I've been working on a variant of a gnomish shrinking ray
column4: but I'm using superior GOBLIN technological advances in its construction! In an effort to avoid inconveniences for myself such as death
column5: I'd like for you to try it out on any of the giants in Feralas. You should find miniaturization residue on them after you shrink them - bring me back some!

column1: Empty Stables^51^Alliance^Alterac Valley^Stormpike Stable Master^Stormpike Stable Master^^^^Locate an Alterac Ram in Alterac Valley. Use the Stormpike Training Collar when you are near the Alterac Ram to 'tame' the beast. Once tamed
column2: the Alterac Ram will follow you back to the Stable Master. Speak with the Stable Master to earn credit for the capture.^Just look at the stables
column3: <name>! Empty! The Stormpike Brigade has no rams to ride - the cavalry is defunct. You must help us
column4: soldier. Take this training collar and enter the wilds of this valley. Locate the Alterac rams that roam throughout the area and use the collar to snare one. When you have captured a ram
column5: return it to me and I shall place it in our stable. When we have enough rams
column6: the ram rider commander will be notifed. With your help
column7: the cavalry will be reborn!

column1: Twisted Evils^47^All^Maraudon^Willow^Willow^^^^Collect 15 Theradric Crystal Carvings for Willow in Desolace.^The crystal caverns of Terramok lie to the west
column2: deep within Maraudon... It is an ancient place with much history. And I am looking to get my hands on some of it
column3: <class>. Relics of the old gods lie hidden behind the giant doors. If you are willing to brave the twisted evils found in Maraudon
column4: I believe I can make it worth your time. Collect the theradric crystal carvings you find
column5: and return them to me. Once I get the carvings
column6: I will be able to... study them. These powers have been too long at rest...

column1: Vyletongue Corruption^47^Horde^Maraudon^Vark Battlescar^Vark Battlescar^^^^Fill the Coated Cerulean Vial at the orange crystal pool in Maraudon.^A satyr known as Vyletongue has corrupted the caverns of Maraudon
column2: stunting the growth of many of the plants inside. Take this vial
column3: <name>. Fill it at the orange crystal pool found inside the caverns; the coating inside the vial will counter the toxins
column4: turning it into a healing agent. Find the Vylestem vines inside the orange caverns
column5: and use the purified liquid on them. The corruption will be purged from the plant
column6: but do know that Vyletongue will still control it. He may use it against you...

column1: Vyletongue Corruption^47^Alliance^Maraudon^Talendria^Talendria^^^^Fill the Coated Cerulean Vial at the orange crystal pool in Maraudon.^A satyr known as Vyletongue has corrupted the caverns of Maraudon
column2: stunting the growth of many of the plants inside. Take this vial
column3: <name>. Fill it at the corrupted orange pool found inside the caverns; the coating inside the vial will counter the toxins
column4: turning it into a healing agent. Find the Vylestem vines inside the orange caverns
column5: and use the purified liquid on them. The corruption will be purged from the plant
column6: but do know that Vyletongue will still control it. He may use it against you...

column1: Legends of Maraudon^49^All^Maraudon^Cavindra^Celebras the Redeemed^^^The Scepter of Celebras^Recover the two parts of the Scepter of Celebras: the Celebrian Rod and the Celebrian Diamond.^A dark satyr called Lord Vyletongue spread his evil through these twisting caves
column2: poisoning the minds of all inside. He still resides beyond the purple crystals. Vyletongue also created a living symbol of his corruption called Noxxion that dwells beyond the orange crystals. Together
column3: they have stolen the two parts of my brother's scepter. Celebras
column4: my brother... he wanders blindly inside
column5: cursed by corruption. You must help him! Find the pieces
column6: and speak to my brother... somehow.

column1: The Scepter of Celebras^49^All^Maraudon^Celebras the Redeemed^Celebras the Redeemed^^Legends of Maraudon^^Assist Celebras the Redeemed while he creates the Scepter of Celebras.^My scepter was once a source of hope for me. It once granted me power over these caverns. I had hoped to bring peace to the spirit of my uncle... For the two parts to once again become one
column2: I will need your assistance in performing the ritual. Please follow me
column3: and listen to my instructions while I channel the energy required to reunite the rod with the diamond. Together
column4: we shall create the Scepter of Celebras once again!

column1: Corruption of Earth and Seed^51^Horde^Maraudon^Selendra^Selendra^^^^Slay Princess Theradras and return to Selendra near Shadowprey Village in Desolace.^Deep in Maraudon lives an evil creature of chaos--Princess Theradras is an elemental force of earth related to the Old Gods. Ages ago
column2: she and Zaetar
column3: first son of Cenarius
column4: began a relationship. The offspring of their time together became known to the people of Kalimdor as centaur. Ever-thankful creatures
column5: the centaur killed Zaetar
column6: and now hold Zaetar's remains. My quest here is to find those powerful enough to slay Theradras so we may recover Zaetar's remains before returning to Stonetalon.

column1: Corruption of Earth and Seed^51^Alliance^Maraudon^Keeper Marandis^Keeper Marandis^^^^Slay Princess Theradras and return to Keeper Marandis at Nijel's Point in Desolace.^In the depths of Maraudon lives a creature of chaos and evil
column2: <name>. Princess Theradras is an elemental force of earth related somehow to the Old Gods. Ages ago
column3: she was sought out by Zaetar
column4: first son of Cenarius. The offspring of their... relationship are the creatures known as centaur. Ever-thankful creatures
column5: the centaur killed Zaetar
column6: and now Theradras keeps his remains. My quest here is to find those powerful enough to slay Theradras so we may recover Zaetar's remains before returning to Stonetalon.

column1: Seed of Life^51^All^Maraudon^Zaetar's Spirit^Keeper Remulos^^^^Seek out Remulos in Moonglade and give him the Seed of Life.^The misbegotten centaur--my sons and daughters--have need of their father. Look around you--this place rings of hope and all that my father Cenarius preaches. It sprung from me! And I cannot take that away from them... not even for their crimes against me. But there is one thing I would ask of you to ease my brother's mind. Take this... it is the first seed that fell from the life my remains nourished. Tell him my spirit remains here
column2: and that I live on. I am sure he will understand.

column1: The Pariah's Instructions^48^All^Maraudon^Centaur Pariah^Centaur Pariah^^^^Read the Pariah's Instructions. Afterwards
column2: obtain the Amulet of Union from Maraudon and return it to the Centaur Pariah in southern Desolace.^Though exiled as a heretic
column3: my beliefs still ring true--that alone drives me onward. But for my destiny to be complete
column4: I need the aid of an outsider... one not of any centaur tribe. The task requires someone to enter the holy halls of Maraudon--a tomb my people protect
column5: and only the most devout are ever allowed to enter. If you agree to aid me
column6: then you need only nod. I will pass you a parchment with my instructions on it. Read it over and consider my words.

column1: Shadowshard Fragments^42^Horde^Maraudon^Uthel'nay^Uthel'nay^^^^Collect 10 Shadowshard Fragments from Maraudon and return them to Uthel'nay in Orgrimmar.^Strong magics be found in the centaur holy place... the holy place of Maraudon. The Desolace tribes of centaur protect that place wit' their lives
column2: but they canna stop us from takin' what we need. You
column3: you head to this Maraudon place and find the rock creatures made of shadowshard. You bring me the purple crystals
column4: and Uthel'nay make you somethin' for your time. The place be dangerous
column5: so maybe you be bringing some friends.

column1: Shadowshard Fragments^42^Alliance^Maraudon^Archmage Tervosh^Archmage Tervosh^^^^Collect 10 Shadowshard Fragments from Maraudon and return them to Archmage Tervosh in Theramore on the coast of Dustwallow Marsh.^I've recently begun testing various crystals and their arcane properties. Lady Proudmoore has given me leave to ask travelers heading into Desolace to seek out a place called Maraudon. Within the ruined temple are great elementals composed of purplish stones I've named shadowshards. If you decide to head that direction and find some of the crystals
column2: I would be very thankful. I could even fashion you a trinket from them if you so desired.

column1: Alterac Valley Graveyards^51^Alliance^Alterac Valley^Sergeant Durgen Stormpike^Sergeant Durgen Stormpike^^^^Assault a graveyard
column2: then return to Sergeant Durgen Stormpike in the Alterac Mountains.^The graveyards in Alterac Valley are prized territories. Both the Horde and the Alliance fight savagely for these sacred grounds. Are you
column3: <name>
column4: ready to join that fight? I want you to assault an enemy graveyard. Find a graveyard with a Horde banner in its midst
column5: and pull it from the ground! Do that
column6: and your task will be complete.... But if you can also hold the graveyard for a few minutes
column7: then our troops will soon come to relieve you.

column1: The Graveyards of Alterac^51^Horde^Alterac Valley^Corporal Teeka Bloodsnarl^Corporal Teeka Bloodsnarl^^^^Assault a graveyard
column2: then return to Corporal Teeka Bloodsnarl in the Alterac Mountains.^The battle lines of Alterac Valley are ever shifting. Territories swing back and forth as we meet our opponents in deadly combat. And graveyards
column3: <name>
column4: are where battles rage most fierce. I want you to attack an Alliance held graveyard! Find a graveyard with an Alliance banner in its midst and pull it from the ground. Do that and your task for me will be complete
column5: but... if you hold the graveyard for a few minutes
column6: then it will be ours and troops will come and relieve you.

column1: Towers and Bunkers^51^Horde^Alterac Valley^Corporal Teeka Bloodsnarl^Corporal Teeka Bloodsnarl^^^^Capture an enemy tower
column2: then return to Corporal Teeka Bloodsnarl in the Alterac Mountains.^Towers and bunkers are important positions
column3: and we must capture and hold them all! So to that end
column4: I want you to attack a bunker that is controlled by the enemy. To do that
column5: enter one with an Alliance banner. You will see another banner inside. Pull out that banner
column6: and a white Horde banner will appear in its place. Well done! At that point your task for me will be complete
column7: but if you hold the place long enough
column8: and if the Alliance doesn't take it back
column9: then it will be destroyed!

column1: Towers and Bunkers^51^Alliance^Alterac Valley^Sergeant Durgen Stormpike^Sergeant Durgen Stormpike^^^^Destroy the banner at an enemy tower or bunker
column2: then return to Sergeant Durgen Stormpike in the Alterac Mountains.^Towers and bunkers are key defensive positions
column3: and so we must hold as many as possible! I want you to attack a tower or a bunker in Alterac Valley. To do that
column4: enter a tower with a Horde banner atop it. You will see another enemy banner inside. Pull out that banner
column5: and a white Alliance banner will appear in its place. Well done! At that point your mission for me will be complete
column6: but hold the area long enough
column7: and if the Horde doesn't take it back
column8: then it will be destroyed!

column1: The Quartermaster^51^Alliance^Alterac Valley^Mountaineer Boombellow^Stormpike Quartermaster^^^^Speak with the Stormpike Quartermaster.^<name>
column2: our quartermaster charged me to direct new recruits to him. He needs supplies from caches stored in the mines of Alterac
column3: and he'll probably send you to get them. Follow the road. You'll find our quartermaster to the west.

column1: Capture a Mine^51^Alliance^Alterac Valley^Sergeant Durgen Stormpike^Sergeant Durgen Stormpike^^^^Capture a mine that the Stormpike does not control
column2: then return to Sergeant Durgen Stormpike in the Alterac Mountains.^The mines in Alterac Valley hold more than just minerals. Both the Frostwolf and Stormpike have cached excess supplies in the Irondeep and Coldtooth mines... that's not a bad idea
column3: if we could only maintain control of them! Capture a mine
column4: then return to me. To capture a mine
column5: enter one that we do not control and kill its leader. When you do that
column6: the mine will be ours
column7: and we'll send troops to protect it!

column1: Speak with our Quartermaster^51^Horde^Alterac Valley^Jotek^Frostwolf Quartermaster^^^^Speak with the Frostwolf Quartermaster.^<name>
column2: the Frostwolf Quartermaster is looking for recruits
column3: for tasks that lead into the mines of Alterac Valley. Speak with him; he will tell you more. Follow the road west into the bunker
column4: then take the west exit and you'll find our quartermaster.

column1: Capture a Mine^51^Horde^Alterac Valley^Corporal Teeka Bloodsnarl^Corporal Teeka Bloodsnarl^^^^Capture a mine
column2: then return to Corporal Teeka Bloodsnarl in the Alterac Mountains.^As battle rages over the landscape of Alterac Valley
column3: so too does it rage through the Coldtooth and Irondeep mines. Both are rich sources of minerals and both are used to store supplies; it's no wonder they are so highly valued! Help our war effort
column4: <name>! Capture one of the mines for the Horde! To capture a mine
column5: enter one that we do not control and kill its leader. When that is done
column6: the mine will be ours and we'll send troops to protect it!

column1: The Battle of Alterac^51^Alliance^Alterac Valley^Prospector Stonehewer^Prospector Stonehewer^Speak with Prospector Stonehewer^^Hero of the Stormpike^Enter Alterac Valley
column2: defeat the Horde general Drek'thar
column3: and then return to Prospector Stonehewer in the Alterac Mountains.^The Explorers' League believes there are artifacts in Alterac Valley
column4: but the Frostwolf orcs won't let us explore. We can't allow the Horde to stop our scholarly pursuits! Defeat the Frostwolf general
column5: Drek'Thar. With him dead
column6: the orcs will lose their edge. Drek'Thar is in Frostwolf Keep
column7: in the south of Alterac Valley. Vanquish him
column8: and then return to me.

column1: The Battle for Alterac^51^Horde^Alterac Valley^Voggah Deathgrip^Voggah Deathgrip^Speak with Voggah Deathgrip^^Hero of the Frostwolf^Enter Alterac Valley and defeat the dwarven general
column2: Vanndar Stormpike. Then
column3: return to Voggah Deathgrip in the Alterac Mountains.^The Stormpike dwarves and their allies have invaded Alterac Valley
column4: and we must drive them out! To win the battle for Alterac
column5: we must defeat their general
column6: Vanndar Stormpike! You will find Vanndar in Dun Baldar
column7: in the north of Alterac Valley. Destroy him
column8: <name>
column9: and then return to me.

column1: Proving Grounds^51^All^Alterac Valley^Warmaster Laggrond^Warmaster Laggrond^^^Rise and Be Recognized^Travel to the Wildpaw cavern located southeast of the main base in Alterac Valley and find the Frostwolf Banner. Return the Frostwolf Banner to Warmaster Laggrond.^Hail
column2: <class>. It has been a long time since we have had the chance to answer the call of battle. The old feelings are slow to rise but once awakened
column3: the blood does rush. The battle rage returns... All newcomers to the Valley must first complete the rite of battle. Deep within the Wildpaw gnoll cave is a banner of the Frostwolf. Venture forth and recover the banner. Return it to me and I shall grant you the Frostwolf initiate's insignia.

column1: Proving Grounds^51^Alliance^Alterac Valley^Lieutenant Haggerdin^Lieutenant Haggerdin^^^Rise and Be Recognized^Travel to the Icewing Caverns located southwest of Dun Baldar in Alterac Valley and recover the Stormpike Banner. Return the Stormpike Banner to Lieutenant Haggerdin in the Alterac Mountains.^You've arrived just in time
column2: <class>. These Frostwolf savages just won't give up! We must show them the might of the Stormpike. They must bow to our superiority. Before you make your way to the field of battle
column3: you will want to join the rank of Stormpike. Southwest of Dun Baldar
column4: you will find the Icewing Caverns. Planted deep within the caverns is a Stormpike Banner. Venture forth and recover that banner. Return it to me
column5: and you will have earned a Stormpike initiate's insignia.

column1: The Legend of Korrak^60^Horde^Alterac Valley^Warmaster Laggrond^Warmaster Laggrond^^^^According to legend
column2: the leader of the mighty Winterax trolls appears at will to wreak havoc on the denizens of Alterac Valley.^The invading Stormpike are not the only threat in the region
column3: soldier. The war in the Valley is waged on two fronts. The cannibal Winterax trolls also vie for power. They are lead by Korrak the Bloodrager - a cruel and cunning beast. A strike against Korrak could prove to be a crushing blow to the Winterax clan. Slay the beast and be rewarded!

column1: The Last Element^54^Horde^Blackrock Depths^Shadowmage Vivian Lagrave^Shadowmage Vivian Lagrave^^Disharmony of Flame^^Travel to Blackrock Depths and recover 10 Essence of the Elements. Your first inclination is to search the golems and golem makers. You remember Vivian Lagrave also muttering something about elementals.^There is work to be had for those venturing into the depths
column2: <name>. The Dark Irons have mastered creation of extremely powerful golems. Initial reports from our spies indicate that the dwarves use a unique power source to give their creations incomparable killing power. Just imagine what we could do with our abominations if we could get our hands on this essence of the elements! Turn that city upside down if you must
column3: but do not return until you have found the essence! Payment will be worth the risk.

column1: Korrak the Bloodrager^60^Alliance^Alterac Valley^Lieutenant Haggerdin^Lieutenant Haggerdin^^^^According to legend
column2: the leader of the mighty Winterax trolls appears at will to wreak havoc on the denizens of Alterac Valley.^The indigenous Winterax trolls of the region are ruthless savages that would love nothing more than to have our bones added to their foul stew. We must show them our might! We have recovered tomes from their caves that detail their leadership hierarchy. The artifacts indicate that their leader
column3: Korrak the Bloodrager
column4: tends to remain hidden until given a reason to make his presence known. Death to Korrak would mean death to Winterax Clan! Slay him and return.

column1: Armor Scraps^51^Alliance^Alterac Valley^Murgot Deepforge^Murgot Deepforge^^^More Armor Scraps^Bring 20 Armor Scraps to Murgot Deepforge in Dun Baldar.^Battles rage constantly in Alterac Valley
column2: and the supplies we get from Ironforge are not enough to outfit our experienced troops. If you find armor scraps from the battlefield
column3: aid the war effort and bring those scraps to me!

column1: Enemy Booty^51^Horde^Alterac Valley^Smith Regzar^Smith Regzar^^^More Booty!^Bring 20 Armor Scraps to Smith Regzar in Frostwolf Village.^When you fight the enemy
column2: gather the scraps of their armor and bring them to me. I'll use those scraps to make armor for our own troops!

column1: In Defense of Frostwolf^51^Horde^Alterac Valley^Frostwolf Ambassador Rokhstrom^Warmaster Laggrond^^^^Venture to Alterac Valley
column2: located in the Alterac Mountains. Find and speak with Warmaster Laggrond - who stands outside the tunnel entrance - to begin your career as a soldier of Frostwolf. You will find Alterac Valley north of Tarren Mill at the base of the Alterac Mountains.^The drums of war sound off in a distant land
column3: <class>. The favored clan of your Warchief is under attack from the nefarious Stormpike Guard of Ironforge. By the looks of you
column4: I can discern that you are indeed battle hardy and prepared to take on the cause of the Frostwolf. It is you who must now take the next step in your evolution. North of Tarren Mill
column5: in Alterac
column6: you will find the entrance to Alterac Valley. It is there that you will find Warmaster Laggrond. Hurry <class>
column7: for the battle is upon us!

column1: The Sovereign Imperative^51^Alliance^Alterac Valley^Lieutenant Rotimer^Lieutenant Haggerdin^^^^Travel to Alterac Valley in the Hillsbrad Foothills. Outside of the entrance tunnel
column2: find and speak with Lieutenant Haggerdin.^We are fighting a brutal battle in the valleys of Alterac. The savage Frostwolf Clan challenges the might of the Stormpike! They must be exterminated in the name of King Magni Bronzebeard! The taking
column3: culling
column4: and turning of that land is a sovereign and territorial imperative to the kingdom of Ironforge. Alas
column5: soldiers do not grow on trees! Report to Lieutenant Haggerdin outside Alterac Valley to begin your tour of duty and honor amongst the Stormpike.

column1: Soothing Turtle Bisque^31^Horde^Cooking^Christoph Jeffcoat^Christoph Jeffcoat^^^^Bring 10 pieces of Turtle Meat to Christoph Jeffcoat in Tarren Mill.^Who says that the undead don't know anything about cooking? Take my secret recipe for Turtle Bisque
column2: for example. I've known folks that would come back from the dead just to enjoy a bowl! Heh
column3: heh... Speaking of which
column4: I haven't been able to make any lately. I used to head over to Lake Lordamere myself to hunt snapjaws
column5: the nasty things
column6: but I can't pull myself away from my work here. If you bring me some Turtle Meat from the snapjaws
column7: I'll show you how it's done!

column1: Favor Amongst the Darkspear^60^Horde^Alterac Valley^Najak Hexxen^Najak Hexxen^^^^You have been tasked with slaying opposing night elf players in Alterac Valley.^<Najak snarls.> Before the night elves existed there was troll. It was from troll that the night elves came. Their mutinous attacks against my people will not be tolerated. Staghelm seeks to wipe us out - to leave no trace of those that bore him and his ilk. It will not happen! For every night elf that you slay and decapitate
column2: Najak will grant you favor amongst the Darkspear. Word of your deeds will be spread across Kalimdor and the Eastern Kingdoms. Go now and serve the Darkspear!

column1: Ally of the Tauren^60^Horde^Alterac Valley^Ravak Grimtotem^Ravak Grimtotem^^^^You have been tasked with slaying opposing gnome players in Alterac Valley.^The Elder Crone has sent me to this warzone to research the other races. More specifically
column2: I am to collect gnome samples. Magatha is primarily interested in their survivability. Aye
column3: the gnomes - while pitifully weak and miniscule - exude great resilience both in and out of combat. Fortunately for you
column4: I am looking for ruffians to do Magatha's bidding. Return to me with tufts of gnome hair and you shall be known to the tauren as an ally.

column1: Defusing the Threat^51^Alliance^Alterac Valley^Stormpike Explosives Expert^Stormpike Explosives Expert^^^^Find the Frostwolf Explosives Expert and kill him. Return to the Stormpike Explosives Expert when the task is complete.^The Frostwolf have their front lines and bases booby trapped
column2: <class>. You have to watch your step when invading enemy territory. If you want to make a solid strike against them
column3: you must destroy their source of anti personnel munitions - I'm talking about their explosives expert. If you kill him
column4: you are safe to disarm the mines. As long as he is kept down
column5: the mines will also stay down. You will probably find him in a tower near the Iceblood Garrison. Good luck!

column1: Defusing the Threat^51^Horde^Alterac Valley^Frostwolf Explosives Expert^Frostwolf Explosives Expert^^^^Find the Stormpike Explosives Expert and kill him. Return to the Frostwolf Explosives Expert when the task is complete.^I know all about landmines. I'm the one that lays all the mines on the front lines here
column2: after all. If you want to defuse the Stormpike mine fields
column3: all you have to do is kill their explosives expert. That dwarven coward is no doubt hiding in the first tower on the Field of Strife. Take him out and those landmines won't come back after they've been disarmed. If you do happen to kill him
column4: come back here and let me know. No good deed should go unrewarded.

column1: The Return of Korrak^60^Horde^Alterac Valley^Warmaster Laggrond^Warmaster Laggrond^^^^Should Korrak the Bloodrager make a return to the Field of Strife
column2: seek him out and destroy him.^While it is true that Korrak has been slain
column3: one question remains: Will he remain dead? Trolls are notorious for their other-worldly tribal magics. I would not be surprised if the fallen leader was raised from the dead to once more rule over his clan. You know what to do should this ever occur. <Warmaster Laggrond makes a cutting motion across his neck with his index finger.> And this time
column4: I want his skull. Just keep your eyes peeled
column5: soldier. Dismissed!

column1: Korrak the Everliving^60^Alliance^Alterac Valley^Lieutenant Haggerdin^Lieutenant Haggerdin^^^^Should Korrak the Bloodrager make a return to the Field of Strife
column2: seek him out and destroy him.^There's something not quite right about all of this... Did anybody think to burn Korrak's corpse? Those trolls will stop at nothing to revive their fallen leader - as blue skinned pagan man-beasts often do. Just keep your eyes out
column3: <name>. Don't be alarmed if Korrak makes a surprise appearance; and if he does
column4: I want him executed - his corpse burned to ashes. For good measure
column5: lop off his head and bring me his skull before you ignite the lifeless mass.

column1: Crown of the Earth^11^All^Teldrassil^Corithras Moonrage^Corithras Moonrage^Crown of the Earth^^^Fill the Amethyst Phial and bring it back to Corithras Moonrage in Dolanaar.^All was not well with Teldrassil
column2: however. Staghelm's carefully made plans for the new World Tree had borne out as he had hoped
column3: but there was one small problem
column4: a problem to which many of the troubles on Teldrassil may be attributed. However
column5: I will not get into that yet. You must visit the last moonwell
column6: to the northwest in the Oracle Glade. Under the boughs of the Oracle Tree lies the first and most powerful of our wells. Retrieve a phial of its water and return to me.

column1: Pusillin and the Elder Azj'Tordin^58^All^Dire Maul^Azj'Tordin^Azj'Tordin^^^^Travel to Dire Maul and locate the Imp
column2: Pusillin. Convince Pusillin to give you Azj'Tordin's Book of Incantations through any means necessary.^I had let my guard down for only one moment
column3: stranger. In my haste to escape the grip of the fallen Prince
column4: I was robbed. A most foul demon
column5: the imp Pusillin
column6: pilfered my book of incantations and the key to the once great halls of Eldre'Thalas. I no longer hold interest in the key
column7: as I have exchanged my immortality for freedom
column8: but I desperately need my book of incantations. Find the imp
column9: Pusillin
column10: and recover my book. Search the Warpwood Quarter of Dire Maul for Pusillin.

column1: The Madness Within^60^All^Dire Maul^Shen'dralar Ancient^Shen'dralar Ancient^The Madness Within^^The Treasure of the Shen'dralar^You must destroy the guardians surrounding the 5 Pylons that power the Prison of Immol'thar. Once the Pylons have powered down
column2: the force field surrounding Immol'thar will have dissipated.^Have you heard enough? Are you a <man/woman> of action? This madness must come to an end. The age of the immortals has long since passed. Destroy the guardians surrounding the pylons to lower the force field. When this is done
column3: destroy Immol'thar. With the Prince's power greatly reduced
column4: attack and end him. Lay the spirits of this city to rest
column5: adventurer.

column1: The Treasure of the Shen'dralar^60^Alliance^Dire Maul^Shen'dralar Ancient^Treasure of the Shen'dralar^^The Madness Within^^Return to the Athenaeum and find the Treasure of the Shen'dralar. Claim your reward!^In the library
column2: Athenaeum
column3: you will find an ancient chest hidden beneath the stairway. Take from it that which you desire.

column1: Arcane Refreshment^60^All^Mage^Lorekeeper Lydros^Lorekeeper Lydros^^^^Travel to the Warpwood Quarter of Dire Maul and slay the water elemental
column2: Hydrospawn. Return to Lorekeeper Lydros in the Athenaeum with the Hydrospawn Essence.^A <race> mage! How wonderous. I have not seen one of your kind for... oh what is it going on now? 500 years! I have something that will quench your thirst
column3: but first you must do a task for me. <Lydros snickers.> There is an anomaly in Eldre'Thalas. A water elemental has taken residence in the east wing. His presence must be catalogued! Venture to the Warpwood Quarter and extract a portion of the elemental essence of the Hydrospawn. Return it to me and I shall teach you a useful cantrip.

column1: Elven Legends^60^Horde^Dire Maul^Sage Korolusk^Sage Korolusk^^^^Search Dire Maul for Kariel Winthalus. Report back to Sage Korolusk at Camp Mojache with whatever information that you may find.^Several years ago
column2: a lone elven master named Kariel Winthalus fled the devastation of his homeland with several ancient elven artifacts in tow. Our search for this lost master lead us from the ruins of Quel'Thalas
column3: through the Burning Steppes
column4: across the great expanses of the sea
column5: to Feralas. We suspect that the elf sought sanctuary in the halls of Eldre'Thalas (what is now known as Dire Maul). You must find him
column6: adventurer. Whether alive or dead
column7: the knowledge he carried must be recovered!

column1: Elven Legends^60^Alliance^Dire Maul^Scholar Runethorn^Scholar Runethorn^^^^Search Dire Maul for Kariel Winthalus. Report back to Scholar Runethorn at Feathermoon with whatever information that you may find.^Several years ago
column2: a lone elven master named Kariel Winthalus fled the devastation of his homeland with several ancient elven artifacts in tow. Our search for this lost master lead us from the ruins of Quel'Thalas
column3: through the Burning Steppes
column4: across the great expanses of the sea
column5: to Feralas. We suspect that the elf sought sanctuary in the halls of Eldre'Thalas (what is now known as Dire Maul). You must find him
column6: adventurer. Whether alive or dead
column7: the knowledge he carried must be recovered!

column1: Libram of Focus^60^All^Dire Maul^Lorekeeper Lydros^Lorekeeper Lydros^^^^Bring a Libram of Focus
column2: 1 Pristine Black Diamond
column3: 4 Large Brilliant Shards
column4: and 2 Skin of Shadow to Lorekeeper Lydros in Dire Maul to receive an Arcanum of Focus.^This libram almost aroused interest in one of the younger Lorekeeper's familiars. Poor thing
column5: it was only a few weeks old. Those among you who are more magically inclined might find this item interesting. The Libram of Focus was lost in this wing. I can only assume one of the Highborne spirits holds it in their possession. Bring the Libram along with some large brilliant shards
column6: skin of shadow
column7: and a pristine black diamond and I shall conjure the Arcanum.

column1: Libram of Protection^60^All^Dire Maul^Lorekeeper Lydros^Lorekeeper Lydros^^^^Bring a Libram of Protection
column2: 1 Pristine Black Diamond
column3: 2 Large Brilliant Shards
column4: and 1 Frayed Abomination Stitching to Lorekeeper Lydros in Dire Maul to receive an Arcanum of Protection.^He wept like an infant at the loss of this libram. Mind you
column5: I myself have wept over texts - there is no greater loss than that of knowledge and history - but to cry over this nearly useless jumbling of incantations? Preposterous! It left me to believe that the Prince was doing him a favor in flaying the flesh from his bones. Bring the Libram along with a pristine black diamond
column6: large brilliant shards
column7: and a frayed abomination stitching and I shall recreate the Arcanum. Oh
column8: and check the north wing.

column1: A Hero's Reward^60^All^Azshara^Duke Hydraxis^Hydraxis' Coffer^^Hands of the Enemy^^Claim your reward from Hydraxis' Coffer.^<name>
column2: your services to the Warlords surpassed all we could expect from the denizens of this world. We do not understand your people's notions of gratitude
column3: or rewarding good works
column4: but in this case... perhaps a reward is warranted. Under the surf at the southern base of this island
column5: you will find a coffer. In it you will find your... reward. Go
column6: <name>. Claim your reward.

column1: Attunement to the Core^60^Horde^Molten Core^Lothos Riftwaker^Lothos Riftwaker^^^^Venture to the Molten Core entry portal in Blackrock Depths and recover a Core Fragment. Return to Lothos Riftwaker in Blackrock Mountain when you have recovered the Core Fragment.^Rifts stir
column2: tear
column3: and collapse all around us
column4: <race>. Not two paces from where I stand is a tear leading through the depths of Blackrock Mountain
column5: into the maw of the Firelord. Surprised? Pity... The mortal races cannot comprehend that which they cannot see
column6: touch
column7: or feel. I assure you
column8: the portal is there and access is possible. I've piqued your interest? Attunement is simple. Venture into Blackrock Depths and retrieve a core fragment. Return it to me and I shall attune your essence with the portal.

column1: Lethtendris's Web^57^Alliance^Dire Maul^Latronicus Moonspear^Latronicus Moonspear^Feathermoon Stronghold^^^Bring Lethtendris' Web to Latronicus Moonspear at the Feathermoon Stronghold in Feralas.^The mage Lethtendris
column2: a vicious blood elf whose brutality is matched only by her twisted addiction to magic
column3: has fled into Dire Maul. She has created a device
column4: a web to ensnare the magical energies of that place and we fear that
column5: if left unchecked
column6: she will cause irreparable damage to our world! Stop her
column7: <name>. Find her and retrieve her web. She is likely near the satyrs in Warpwood Quarter of Dire Maul. Bring the web to me so that its power may be released safely back into the wilds...

column1: Lethtendris's Web^57^Horde^Dire Maul^Talo Thornhoof^Talo Thornhoof^Camp Mojache^^^Bring Lethtendris's Web to Talo Thornhoof at Camp Mojache in Feralas.^The blood elf Lethtendris has overstepped her bounds. So eager was she to gather magical power that she defied her brethren and created a device of insidious design
column2: a web meant to siphon the tainted magical energies of Dire Maul. Even now she gathers those energies and plans to release them against her enemies. Lethtendris must be stopped. Find her within the Warpwood Quarter of Dire Maul
column3: defeat her and bring her web to me so that it might be returned to more clear-headed blood elves for study.

column1: Victory for the Horde^60^Horde^Orgrimmar^Head of Onyxia^ ^Victory for the Horde^^^Take the Head of Onyxia to Thrall in Orgrimmar.^You have accomplished the impossible. The brood mother of the Black Dragonflight lies dead at your feet. Take her head and present it to your Warchief.
Camp Mojache^57^Horde^Dire Maul^Harbinger Balthazad^Talo Thornhoof^Camp Mojache^^^Speak with Talo Thornhoof at Camp Mojache in Feralas.^Talo Thornhoof
column2: a Tauren elder in Feralas
column3: sends a request for aid. He offered few details
column4: but he did say that he needs agents for a matter both delicate... and dire. Serve the Horde
column5: <name>. Go to Camp Mojache in Feralas and speak with Talo.

column1: Feathermoon Stronghold^57^Alliance^Dire Maul^Crier Goodman^Latronicus Moonspear^Feathermoon Stronghold^^^Speak with Latronicus Moonspear at the Feathermoon Stronghold in Feralas.^<name>! Your aid is needed in Feralas! An outlaw mage
column2: Lethtendris
column3: has fled to the ancient elven ruins Eldre'thalas
column4: now called Dire Maul. It is believed she has an item of dangerous magical energy which must be recovered. Latronicus Moonspear requests agents to enter Dire Maul and retrieve the item from Lethtendris. Serve the Alliance! Seek out Latronicus at the Feathermoon Stronghold in Feralas.

column1: Victory for the Alliance^60^Alliance^Stormwind City^Head of Onyxia^ ^Victory for the Alliance^^^Take the Head of Onyxia to King Varian Wrynn in Stormwind.^You have accomplished the impossible. The brood mother of the Black Dragonflight lies dead at your feet. Take her head and present it to the King Varian Wrynn.

Mor'zul Bloodbringer^60^Human

column3: ^Warlock^Spackle Thornberry^Mor'zul Bloodbringer^Mor'zul Bloodbringer^^Rage of Blood^Speak with Mor'zul Bloodbringer at the Altar of Storms in the Burning Steppes.^<name>
column4: your delvings into the dark arts are deep. Your mastery over otherworldly denizens has grown so strong... perhaps you are ready to bind to you one of the infamous dreadsteeds. The ritual to summon the beast from its home requires great power and resources
column5: but if you desire to dominate that epic mount
column6: then speak with Mor'zul Bloodbringer. He is camped near the Altar of Storms in the Burning Steppes. Go
column7: <name>. This quest will be perilous
column8: but a Warlock of your stature does not shy from danger!

column1: Rage of Blood^60^Human
column2: Orc
column3: ^Warlock^Mor'zul Bloodbringer^Mor'zul Bloodbringer^Mor'zul Bloodbringer^^Wildeyes^Bring 30 bottles of Raging Beast's Blood to Mor'zul Bloodbringer in the Burning Steppes.^The dreadsteeds dwell on another world
column4: on the fiery Plains of Xoroth
column5: and to bind one of those famed beasts you must invoke powerful glyphs. I can scribe the glyphs on a parchment for you
column6: but first I will need a special ink. In distant Winterspring there dwells a race of owl beasts. Once pure creatures
column7: they were turned mad by the demonic emanations of the Darkwhisper Gorge and now roam the snows in a frenzy. Their blood is what I need to ink your parchment. Bring it to me.

column1: Wildeyes^60^Human

column7: Gorzeeki

column1: The Prison's Bindings^60^All^Warlock^Daio the Decrepit^Daio the Decrepit^^^The Prison's Casing^Travel to Dire Maul in Feralas and recover 15 Satyr Blood from the Wildspawn Satyr that inhabit the Warpwood Quarter. Return to Daio in the Tainted Scar when this is done.^You must retrieve bindings for the prison of the Doomguard from lesser demons. The blood of the Wildspawn satyr that occupy Dire Maul should do nicely. The coagulated blood will bond the Hederine shards and power the crystal prison.

The Prison's Casing^60^All^Warlock^Daio the Decrepit^Daio the Decrepit^^The Prison's Bindings^Suppression^Travel to Darkwhisper Gorge in Winterspring and recover 5 Tears of the Hederine from the Hederine demons that occupy the gorge. Return to Daio in the Tainted Scar when you have completed this task.^The Hederine demons that occupy the foothills of Mount Hyjal secrete powerful fel poisons
column2: which if left to mature
column3: harden into a dense anti-magic crystal. These crystals have come to be known as Tears of the Hederine. Not even the immense power of a Doomguard could break the walls of a prison constructed from this material. Travel to Darkwhisper Gorge in Winterspring and recover the Tears.

column1: Suppression^60^All^Warlock^Daio the Decrepit^Daio the Decrepit^^The Prison's Casing^^Venture forth into the Tainted Scar and locate a Doomguard Commander.^The prison is ready. Now for the most difficult portion of this task. You must find and capture a Doomguard Commander within the Tainted Scar using this crystal prison. Be warned! A Doomguard is a cunning and lethal adversary and will seek to destroy you as you begin the ritual of imprisonment. It will flail wildly in its attempts to escape imprisonment. It will focus on nothing but you
column2: <name>. Because of this
column3: I must recommend that you take companions capable of keeping you alive!

column1: What Niby Commands^50^All^Warlock^Niby the Almighty^Impsy^What Niby Commands^^^Speak with Impsy in Felwood.^If I am to teach you the secrets of summoning an infernal servant
column2: you must destroy Kroshius and bring me the infernal core from his burning remains. This
column3: however
column4: is not as easy as it sounds. Kroshius has all but burned out completely. You must reignite his corpse and raise him from the rubble. To do this
column5: however
column6: you must gather some components from other demonic entities. My imp
column7: Impsy
column8: shall set you on your way.

column1: Flawless Fel Essence^50^All^Warlock^Impsy^Impsy^What Niby Commands^^^Impsy in Felwood has asked that you bring him three Flawless Fel Essences originating from three distinct locations.^If you're going to reanimate Kroshius
column2: you're going to need Fel fire. I can make Fel fire but it's going to require some components. You need to bring me flawless Fel essences from three distinct regions of the world. The Legashi Satyrs of Azshara will have the first essence type; the Jaedenar legionnaires of Jaedenar the second type and the felguard sentries of the Blasted Lands the third. Bring me back one of each essence type and I will create the Fel fire
column3: allowing you to reanimate Kroshius.

column1: Kroshius' Infernal Core^50^All^Warlock^Impsy^Niby the Almighty^What Niby Commands^^^Search Shatter Scar Vale in Felwood for the remains of Kroshius. When you locate the remains
column2: use the Fel Fire near them and await Kroshius' return. When the infernal has awoken
column3: slay him and take from his corpse Kroshius' Infernal Core.^Kroshius lays in a heap to the northeast
column4: in the Shatter Scar Vale. Take this Fel fire and use it on his remains. The fire should reanimate the fallen infernal. At this point
column5: I fully expect him to kill you and your minion. If by some miracle you happen to kill Kroshius
column6: take his infernal core and return it to Niby.

column5: one of my leaves can serve as a quiver the likes of which has not been seen in 10
column6: 000 years. A quiver that when accompanied by a bow of Ancients
column7: could grant untold powers. Return here with sinew from an adult blue dragon and this quiver shall be yours.

column1: Stave of the Ancients^60^All^Hunter^Vartrus the Ancient^Vartrus the Ancient^^The Ancient Leaf^^You must find and destroy these four demonic corrupters:^Agents of the Burning Legion are still active in our world

column3: <name>. Be warned
column4: you must engage them by yourself or they will flee. As long as you are alone
column5: they will try and destroy you. You must strike at them
column6: turning their arrogance into misery. I grant you a piece of my bark
column7: the inscriptions shall lead you to your targets. Retrieve their heads.

column1: Emphasis on Sacrifice^60^Human
column2: Dwarf

column7: time is of the essence.

column4: return to Lord Grayson Shadowbreaker in the Cathedral District of Stormwind.^I have added a pinch of dirt from the tainted ground of Terrordale in the Eastern Plaguelands to the censer. When you have passed sufficient judgment on the spirits there
column5: you will be ready to proceed.

column1: The Work of Grimand Elmore^60^Human
column2: Dwarf

column4: but because of the circumstances involved it must also be sufficiently attuned to the spirit realm. First things first
column5: <name> - let's get your barding made. In Stormwind's Dwarven District is one of the finest craftsmen living today
column6: Grimand Elmore. His work will not be cheap
column7: but his quality is what we seek. Speak with him.

column10: Arthas' Tears for the spiritual attunement
column11: and Stratholme holy water for the spiritual imbuement. Actually

column14: there are some things I can get started on for you while you assemble your collection of goods.

column4: one from an appropriate spirit. In Dire Maul is such a spirit
column5: the Ancient Equine Spirit. It is currently held by a corrupt treant
column6: Tendris Warpwood. Pass judgment upon this foul beast
column7: <name>. Know this - freedom alone is not enough. You must soothe the spirit before receiving its blessing. For that
column8: special horse feed is needed. Travel to Southshore first and speak with Merideth Carlson on this... and prepare for more sacrifice.

column2: Dwarf

column4: it glows ever so slightly. The air is thick with power for a brief moment
column5: and then the barding disappears from the back of the horse and is now secure in your backpack. It would seem that the barding has been blessed. As per Lord Shadowbreaker's instructions
column6: you should now return with it to him in Stormwind.

EVERYONE thought I was mad! Well
column4: now it's payback time! I'll make what you need
column5: PALADIN... so-called CHAMPION... but it will cost you. I need special biscuits - Enriched Manna Biscuits sold only by the Argent Dawn - for this blend. I also demand
column6: yes DEMAND gold as compensation for the misery I have endured! Show me the sacrifice you tout so much
column7: PALADIN.

column4: actually
column5: is almost done. The exorcism censer used in Terrordale is the catalyst for it
column6: and I will fashion a suitable housing for the device. The last components needed
column7: though
column8: are two diamonds. They must be as juxtaposed in brilliance as they are in purpose - an Azerothian and a Pristine Black. These two will be the beacon by which the scryer will pierce the shadows!

column2: Dwarf

I thank you for your trust in me to provide for you the best. No doubt Grayson will want to see the work for himself as well. Take your barding to him
column4: and give him my thanks for his honorable business.

Within the depths of the Scholomance in Lordaeron is a chamber called the Great Ossuary. I need to complete a device that would pierce the shadows of this horrid room. To finish what I have started

column6: Overseer Maltorius
column7: is to be killed an' 'is head brung back as proof o' the deed. See Lookout Captan Lolo Longstriker fer the reward on this bounty.

column2: you will find the sleeping quarters of the Dark Iron dwarves.^If we want to put a dent in the productivity of the Dark Iron forces working out of the Slag Pit
column3: we have to hit them where it's going to hurt the most. It's a little known fact but dwarves
column4: particularly of the Dark Iron variety
column5: need rest! Lots of rest! Now I ask you; How can they sleep without pillows? Exactly
column6: <name>
column7: they can't. This is why you must weasel your way into the Slag Pit and steal their pillows.

column1: Unfinished Gordok Business^60^All^Dire Maul^Captain Kromcrush^Captain Kromcrush^^^^Find the Gauntlet of Gordok Might and return it to Captain Kromcrush in Dire Maul.^Now you da king
column2: so maybe you get prized Gordok artifact back from creepy elf who calls himself Prince! Da king before you failed
column3: just like all da other kings since Tortheldrin - da creepy elf - stole it from old timey Gordok king! Artifact is called da Gauntlet of Gordok Might. Old timey stories say only da one true king da Gordok can get it back. Old timey story also say creepy elf is still around here - you find it and it will become mighty gauntlet you wear forever! Yar
column4: I show you!

column1: Look at the Size of It!^50^All^Searing Gorge^Chambermaid Pillaclencher's Pillow^Evonice Sootsmoker^^^^Take Chambermaid Pillaclencher's Pillow to Evonice Sootsmoker in the Searing Gorge.^Well
column2: well
column3: well... Isn't this a surprise. The Chambermaid had a gigantic ornate pillow and now it's yours. Evonice Sootsmoker will definitely want to get her grubby little hands all over this item. Take it to her and see if she'll offer you any goodies for your trouble.

column1: Fuel for the Zapping^48^All^Feralas^Zorbin Fandazzle^Zorbin Fandazzle^^^Refuel for the Zapping^Collect 10 Water Elemental Cores from the Sea Elementals and Sea Sprays along the Forgotten Coast of Feralas
column2: and bring them back to Zorbin Fandazzle who is near the dock there.^If I bet against my own better judgment and stay to run an engineering shop along the Forgotten Coast
column3: I will need to deal with these pesky elementals. Curse the powers of elementalism unchecked
column4: I say! Fortunately for me
column5: and now for you my hopeful agent provocateur
column6: the elementals represent an ideal source of raw power for my Ultra-Shrinker refinement - give them the what-for I say! When doing this though
column7: be sure to save me the water elemental cores!

column1: What the Flux?^50^All^Searing Gorge^Master Smith Burninate^Master Smith Burninate^^^Restoring Fiery Flux Supplies via Kingsb
column2: Gaining Even More Acceptance
column3: Restoring Fiery Flux Supplies via Iron
column4: Restoring Fiery Flux Supplies via Heavy

column6: Maltorius
column7: left our clan
column8: he left with something more valuable than a pristine arcane crystal: Our recipe for fiery flux! I'd bet anything that the recipe was part of the deal in his new promotion amongst the Dark Irons. I want you to get our secret plans back
column9: <name>. I'm sure they're somewhere near Maltorius
column10: deep inside the Slag Pit.

column1: Curse These Fat Fingers^49^All^Searing Gorge^Hansel Heavyhands^Hansel Heavyhands^^^^Hansel Heavyhands wants you to kill 20 Heavy War Golems.^Unfortunately
column2: I can't dish out the beats like I used to
column3: due to this here fat finger problem. Ye see
column4: the climate out here combined with the lack o' air pressure makes me fingers expand. They're like gigantic Thelsamar Blood Sausages
column5: they are... Ye're gonna have to carry out me orders of business and what have ye. First on me agenda: Poundin' the livin' daylights out o' the heavy war golems o' the Gorge. Get crackin'.

column1: Fiery Menace!^49^All^Searing Gorge^Hansel Heavyhands^Hansel Heavyhands^^^^Hansel Heavyhands wants you to kill 20 Greater Lava Spiders in the Searing Gorge. You can find Greater Lava Spiders in the plateaus and lava pools of the Searing Gorge.^Wouldn't ye know it
column2: every time ol' Hansel wants to take a moment to relax and reflect upon his life
column3: the powers that be give him another job. Me gots to think
column4: come on! Ye know what I be saying? Come. On. So
column5: these here greater lava spiders are causin' a ruckus o' some sort. Oilfist says they shoot fire out their... erm
column6: yea well
column7: anyway
column8: such things upset the children. I guess we gots to kill 'em. Rather
column9: ye gots to kill 'em.

column1: Again With the Zapped Giants^55^All^Feralas^Zorbin Fandazzle^Zorbin Fandazzle^^Zapped Giants^^Use Zorbin's Ultra-Shrinker to zap any kind of giant found in Feralas into a more manageable form. Bring 10 Miniaturization Residues found on the zapped versions of these giants to Zorbin Fandazzle at the docks of the Forgotten Coast
column2: Feralas.^I know you've gathered residue for me already... but should you find yourself for want of an encore performance to a fun-time activity
column3: I can always use more residue. While I can't offer nearly as much in the way of compensation again
column4: I'll be more than happy to spread the good word of your service to all my goblin friends with ears. Believe me <sir /madam> when I say that these goblins have quite large ears.

column1: Refuel for the Zapping^55^All^Feralas^Zorbin Fandazzle^Zorbin Fandazzle^^Fuel for the Zapping^^Collect 6 Water Elemental Cores from the Sea Elementals and Sea Sprays along the Forgotten Coast of Feralas
column2: and bring them back to Zorbin Fandazzle who is near the dock there.^More work
column3: you say? Did my heroic mission of collecting bits of goo found inside elemental beings not slake your thirst for adventure? Perhaps more of the same will vainly try to fill the bottomless well of questing you possess... OK
column4: melodrama aside
column5: I do need more water elemental cores. I'm trying desperately to set up shop here
column6: so the rewards won't be as great... but I promise you I'll tell everyone in earshot how you've helped me. Trust me on this - I know people in the Cartel!

column1: Incendosaurs? Whateverosaur is More Like It^49^All^Searing Gorge^Hansel Heavyhands^Hansel Heavyhands^^^^Hansel Heavyhands wants you to kill 20 Incendosaurs.^Bunions
column2: <lad/lass>. Me bunions got bunions. How am I supposed to do any sort of killin' with me feet in such disarray? That's why ye're gonna help. Scrange and Burninate tasked me to kill these things so they can send some expeditionary teams down into the Slag Pit lava pools to do some explorin'. Supposedly some incendosaurs or some such nonsense down there causin' all kinds o' problems. Now move along an' don't come back 'til the incendosaur population be extinct.

column1: STOLEN: Smithing Tuyere and Lookout's Spyglass^48^All^Searing Gorge^Wanted/Missing/Lost & Found^Taskmaster Scrange^^^^Find and return the Smithing Tuyere and Lookout's Spyglass to Taskmaster Scrange in the Searing Gorge.^The following items have been stolen: *One Dark Iron Tuyere. *One Lookout's Spyglass. A reward is being offered to individuals who find and return these pilfered items. The Thorium Brotherhood is certain that these items were stolen by unscrupulous and jealous Dark Iron dwarves that inhabit the Searing Gorge. The spyglass in question was an excellent tool for the lookouts and the tuyere was an irreplaceable smithing tool. Should you find the missing items
column2: return them to Scrange.

column1: JOB OPPORTUNITY: Culling the Competition^48^All^Searing Gorge^Wanted/Missing/Lost & Found^Taskmaster Scrange^^^^Slay 15 Dark Iron Taskmasters and 15 Dark Iron Slavers. Return to Taskmaster Scrange in the Searing Gorge once you have accomplished this task.^Taskmaster Scrange is looking for a few good men and women to help 'cull the competition' in the Searing Gorge. If you are interested in this position
column2: venture out into the Searing Gorge and slaughter every Dark Iron Taskmaster and Dark Iron Slaver that you see. Return to Taskmaster Scrange when your clothes are bloody enough. You'll know when they're bloody enough so don't ask.

column1: Zukk'ash Infestation^45^Horde^Feralas^Hadoken Swiftstrider^Hadoken Swiftstrider^^The Battle Plans^Zukk'ash Report^Bring 20 Zukk'ash Carapaces to Hadoken Swiftstrider at Camp Mojache
column2: Feralas.^From what scouting we have managed to muster
column3: we believe that the foe south of the gnolls is an insect-like race. Frankly
column4: it is irrelevant whether or not if they're sentient. If they are driving the gnolls to frenzy against us
column5: then they are as big of a threat - if not more - than the gnolls. Drive deep into where these Zukk'ash insects dwell; it is known as the Writhing Deep. Thin their numbers and report back to me what you find
column6: bringing back their carapaces as evidence of your handiwork.

column1: Stinglasher^47^Horde^Feralas^Hadoken Swiftstrider^Hadoken Swiftstrider^^The Battle Plans^Zukk'ash Report^Defeat Stinglasher in the Writhing Deep
column2: bringing its glands back to Hadoken Swiftstrider at Camp Mojache
column3: Feralas.^In surveying the Writhing Deep
column4: one of our scouts reported seeing a giant insect - much larger than the other insects spotted - wandering about the twisted terrain. Not only is it larger
column5: it also seems to secrete some sort of aura that the other insects don't. We've given it a name - Stinglasher. The innards of this beast would be invaluable to study as we figure out the best way to deal with this new threat. Cut out its secretion glands and bring it back to me immediately!

column1: Zukk'ash Report^48^Horde^Feralas^Hadoken Swiftstrider^Zilzibin Drumlore^^Zukk'ash Infestation
column2: Stinglasher^^Deliver the Camp Mojache Zukk'ash Report to Zilzibin Drumlore. He resides in the Drag of Orgrimmar.^You've done doubly well in addressing the threat that the Zukk'ash insects pose to Camp Mojache. The threat these things pose is far from over
column3: and I'd like to ask you for one last task on behalf of the Horde. This is a document that details all the information we have learned about these Zukk'ash insects. I want you to deliver it to Zilzibin Drumlore in the Drag of Orgrimmar. He's an expert on alien creatures like these; I hope he can do something with the lore we've obtained.

column1: Improved Quality^48^Alliance^Feralas^Pratt McGrubben^Pratt McGrubben^^The Mark of Quality^^Bring 10 Rage Scar Yeti Hides to Pratt McGrubben at Feathermoon Stronghold
column2: Feralas.^I have a lead on an even BETTER source of hides
column3: if that's even possible to believe! In the northern parts of Feralas - deep within Rage Scar Hold - are another throng of yetis. They're much tougher than the ones you dealt with before
column4: so if you're up for a bigger challenge you'd best be on your toes! I would reward you handsomely for a stack of ten of their hides; bring them to me here
column5: and we'll finish our business.

column4: so if you're up for a bigger challenge you'd best be on your toes! I would reward you handsomely for a stack of ten of their hides; bring them to me here
column5: and we'll finish our business.

column1: Blackhand's Command^60^All^Blackrock Spire^Blackhand's Command^Drakkisath's Brand^^^^That is one stupid orc. It would appear as if you need to find this brand and gain the Mark of Drakkisath in order to access the Orb of Command.^Imbecile
column2: I hold very little faith in your ability to prevent outsiders from accessing the master's lair. In the very likely event of your death
column3: this orb has its own failsafe built in to prevent outsiders from teleporting directly into Blackwing. Only those with the Mark of Drakkisath branded upon their hand may make use of this orb. Thankfully
column4: Drakkisath is not nearly as incompetent as you
column5: Quartermaster. He guards the brand himself! -Warchief Rend Blackhand P.S. Destroy this letter
column6: idiot.
