column4: to use the materials you provided for his betrayal to wake Thunderfury.

column1: Arena Master^55^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Arena Master^Short John Mithril^^^Arena Grandmaster^Speak with Short John Mithril in the Stranglethorn Arena.^There must be more to being a master of the arena than this! Perhaps the Pirate who runs the event at Gurubashi will know!
Snapjaws
column2: Mon!^50^Horde^The Hinterlands^Katoom the Angler^Katoom the Angler^^^Gammerita
column3: Mon!^Katoom the Angler at Revantusk Village in the Hinterlands wants you to kill 10 Saltwater Snapjaw turtles. Return to him when you have completed this task.^Don't let their big eyes fool you
column4: mon! Those saltwater snapjaws be a menace. I can't fish for five minutes without getting a broken line from one of those oversized fish vacuums stealing my bait. Do me and the people of Revantusk Village a service and kill em
column5: mon. Kill the whole lot of em!

column1: Gammerita
column2: Mon!^48^Horde^The Hinterlands^Katoom the Angler^Katoom the Angler^^Snapjaws
column3: Mon!^^Katoom the Angler at Revantusk Village in the Hinterlands wants you to kill Gammerita and retrieve Katoom's Best Lure from her corpse.^Yo! There be a turtle out there not like the others. She be the Gammerita
column4: leader of the saltwater snapjaws - a downright dirty thievin' reptile. Mon
column5: she stole my best lure. Snapped it right off my line! Since then
column6: the fish just aren't biting the same. Find Gammerita and get my lure out of her stomach.

column1: Stalking the Stalkers^48^Horde^The Hinterlands^Huntsman Markhor^Huntsman Markhor^^^^Huntsman Markhor at Revantusk Village in the Hinterlands wants you to kill 5 Silvermane Stalkers and 5 Silvermane Howlers. Return to him once the task is complete.^Many brave trolls have been lost to the harsh wilds of the Hinterlands
column2: <race>. The Silvermane wolves are one of the biggest threats to our hunters. They lay in wait
column3: hiding amongst the bushes and landscape
column4: then strike out when the opportunity presents itself. This type of ferocity will not go unchecked! You must think like the Silvermane. Stalk the stalkers! Slay them all!

column1: Hunt the Savages^48^Horde^The Hinterlands^Huntsman Markhor^Huntsman Markhor^^^^Huntsman Markhor at Revantusk Village in the Hinterlands wants you to kill 10 Savage Owlbeasts. Return to him once the task is complete.^Among the more ornery of the wildlife of the Hinterlands are the savage owlbeasts. Many a good Revantusk warrior has been lost to the ferocious claws and beak of the beasts. Kill every savage owlbeast you see
column2: <race>. Return to me when you can stand no more bloodshed. Your contribution will then be weighed
column3: measured
column4: and judged.

column1: Avenging the Fallen^48^Horde^The Hinterlands^Huntsman Markhor^Huntsman Markhor^^^^Huntsman Markhor at Revantusk Village in the Hinterlands wants you to kill a Razorbeak Skylord and retrieve its Skylord Plume. Return to him once the task is complete.^The filth that calls itself Wildhammer trains gryphon to slay troll. Horrible
column2: I know
column3: but worry not
column4: justice will soon be meted out. For now
column5: I want you to focus on eradicating the elder gryphons of the region. They are known as Skylords. Slay one and return to me with its plume.

column1: Vilebranch Hooligans^48^Horde^The Hinterlands^Smith Slagtree^Smith Slagtree^^^^Smith Slagtree at Revantusk Village in the Hinterlands wants you to find Slagtree's Lost Tools. Return to him once this task is complete.^Vilebranch scum invaded our village and stole my tools! I have backup tools but the set they stole was a gift given to me by a kind hearted gnome that saved my life when I was a young orc. I want those tools back
column2: <name> - they mean the world to me. Markhor reported that the tools were spotted near the Agol'watha and Shaol'watha temples. Those temples are in the northeastern region of the Hinterlands. Recover my tools!

column1: Lard Lost His Lunch^49^Horde^The Hinterlands^Lard^Lard^^^^Lard at Revantusk Village in the Hinterlands wants you to find Lard's Lunch. Return to him when this task is complete.^Lard was at secret special spot having picnic when ugly mean Vilebranch hit Lard wit da big stick. Lard run back to Revantusk but forget Lard lunch. Lard hungry. Maybe you go back to secret special spot and get Lard lunch? Lard scared. Go nort! Island der to da nort is da secret special spot.
Message to the Wildhammer^48^Horde^The Hinterlands^Otho Moji'ko^Otho Moji'ko^Message to the Wildhammer^^^Otho Moji'ko at Revantusk Village in the Hinterlands wants you to slaughter 8 Highvale Scouts
column2: 5 Highvale Outrunners
column3: 5 Highvale Rangers and 2 Highvale Marksman. Return to him when this task is complete.^The Wildhammer be striking up deals with our enemies
column4: forgin' new alliances. This time
column5: they be workin' with the high elves
column6: mon. <Otho spits.> We be needin' to send those Wildhammer dwarves a message - a message in the blood of our enemies. Slaughter every Highvale high elf that you come across
column7: leave their bodies as a warnin'. Never mess with trolls!

column1: Another Message to the Wildhammer^48^Horde^The Hinterlands^Otho Moji'ko^Otho Moji'ko^Message to the Wildhammer^^^Otho Moji'ko at Revantusk Village in the Hinterlands wants you to bring him 1 Long Elegant Feather from the gryphons that inhabit the Hinterlands. Return to him once this task is complete.^They say the Wildhammer and gryphon are as close to each other as troll and mate. Disgusting
column2: but we be able to use this to our advantage
column3: mon. We send them another message. Kill all the gryphons you see in the Hinterlands and collect a long elegant feather! From this we make the final message.

column1: The Final Message to the Wildhammer^50^Horde^The Hinterlands^Otho Moji'ko^Otho Moji'ko^Message to the Wildhammer^^^Otho Moji'ko at Revantusk Village in the Hinterlands wants you to travel to Aerie Peak in the western region of the Hinterlands and place the Final Message to the Wildhammer by the well in the center of town. Return to him once this task is complete.^<Otho hands you a long
column2: blood drenched spear
column3: wrapped in several gryphon feathers.> You take this
column4: mon. You take this to Aerie Peak
column5: dead center of town by the well. You plant it! Drive it right into the ground! Show those dwarves that troll mean business! Come back when you do this. Hopefully you come back alive.

column1: Cannibalistic Cousins^48^Horde^The Hinterlands^Mystic Yayo'jin^Mystic Yayo'jin^^^^Mystic Yayo'jin at Revantusk Village in the Hinterlands wants you to kill 6 Vilebranch Scalpers and 2 Vilebranch Soothsayers. Return to her when this task is complete.^Three different tribes of trolls inhabit the Hinterlands
column2: <name>. That is about as far as the similarities between the tribes extends: We are all trolls and we live in the Hinterlands. The Vilebranch - aptly named - are a depraved lot; feeding on other trolls and humanoids. If Zul'jin were here
column3: he would have destroyed the whole lot of them with a flick of his wrist - alas
column4: Zul'jin has not yet returned and we are left to our own devices. It is up to you to destroy the filth of the region!

column1: Kidnapped Elder Torntusk!^51^Horde^The Hinterlands^Primal Torntusk^Elder Torntusk^Kidnapped Elder Torntusk!^^^Primal Torntusk at Revantusk Village in the Hinterlands wants you to rescue her mate
column2: Elder Torntusk
column3: from Jintha'alor.^My mate was taken by Vilebranch savages in a bold midnight raid on our village. Our spies have told me that he is still alive and being held prisoner atop Jintha'alor. The Vile Priestess Hexx is said to be preparing him for a sacrifice to the faceless blood God
column4: Hakkar. You must save him
column5: <name>! Our village could not stand a loss this great.

column1: Recover the Key!^51^Horde^The Hinterlands^Elder Torntusk^Elder Torntusk^Kidnapped Elder Torntusk!^^^Elder Torntusk at Jintha'alor wants you to kill Hitah'ya the Keeper to get the Shackle Key to his bindings. Return to Elder Torntusk when you have recovered the key.^The key to my bindings is held by Hitah'ya the Keeper. She is in the nearby cave. Be careful
column2: <class>
column3: for she is guarded well. Kill her and bring the key back to loosen my shackles. Only then will I be free to return home.

column1: Return to Primal Torntusk^51^Horde^The Hinterlands^Elder Torntusk^Primal Torntusk^Kidnapped Elder Torntusk!^^^Elder Torntusk at Jintha'alor wants you to return to Primal Torntusk at Revantusk Village with news of his rescue.^Return to my mate
column2: Primal Torntusk at Revantusk Village. Tell her that I am coming home! She is sure to reward you.

column1: Attunement to the Core^60^Alliance^Molten Core^Lothos Riftwaker^Lothos Riftwaker^^^^Venture to the Molten Core entry portal in Blackrock Depths and recover a Core Fragment. Return to Lothos Riftwaker in Blackrock Mountain when you have recovered the Core Fragment.^Rifts stir
column2: tear
column3: and collapse all around us
column4: <race>. Not two paces from where I stand is a tear leading through the depths of Blackrock Mountain
column5: into the maw of the Firelord. Surprised? Pity... The mortal races cannot comprehend that which they cannot see
column6: touch
column7: or feel. I assure you
column8: the portal is there and access is possible. I've piqued your interest? Attunement is simple. Venture into Blackrock Depths and retrieve a core fragment. Return it to me and I shall attune your essence with the portal.

column1: Separation Anxiety^50^Horde^The Hinterlands^Huntsman Markhor^Huntsman Markhor^^^^Huntsman Markhor at Revantusk Village in the Hinterlands wants you to recover his twin brother's remains. Find and return Huntsman Malkhor's Skull and Huntsman Malkhor's Bones to Huntsman Markhor.^Like many in our village
column2: I too have lost a loved one to the wilds. Alas
column3: it was my twin brother Malkhor - taken in the same raid as Torntusk's mate by the Vilebranch. Sadly
column4: he was not fated to live and was given a swift
column5: brutal execution; his remains fed to the oozes and wolves of the Vilebranch. It is too late to save his life but not too late to save his soul. Recover his remains
column6: <name>.

column1: Dark Vessels^50^Horde^The Hinterlands^Primal Torntusk^Primal Torntusk^^^^Primal Torntusk at Revantusk Village in the Hinterlands wants you to recover 5 Vessels of Tainted Blood from Jintha'alor. Return to Primal Torntusk when this task is complete.^The Vilebranch fight with supernatural ferocity. This is due to the foul magical weavings of the Vile Priestess Hexx. Throughout Jintha'alor you will find dark vessels of tainted blood. The vessels radiate the foul magic of the faceless blood God
column2: empowering the Vilebranch and also driving them to madness. Steal those vessels and return them to me so that I may remove the taint and ultimately loosen the grip of the blood God.

column1: Wanted: Vile Priestess Hexx and Her Minions^51^Horde^The Hinterlands^Call to Arms!^Primal Torntusk^^^^You have been ordered to slay Vile Priestess Hexx and 5 Vilebranch Aman'zasi Guards. See Primal Torntusk at Revantusk Village in the Hinterlands once this task is complete.^By order of Primal Torntusk
column2: Vile Priestess Hexx and her minions are to be brought to justice! A grand reward is offered for any that slay the Vile Priestess Hexx and all of her Aman'zasi elite guard.

column1: Job Opening: Guard Captain of Revantusk Village^51^Horde^The Hinterlands^Call to Arms!^Primal Torntusk^^^^You have been tasked with the decimation of 5 Vilebranch Berserkers
column2: 3 Vilebranch Shadow Hunters
column3: 3 Vilebranch Blood Drinkers
column4: and 2 Vilebranch Soul Eaters.^With the loss of Guard Captain Malkhor
column5: the position of Guard Captain of Revantusk is once again open. If you are interested in becoming Captain of the Guard for Revantusk
column6: complete the following tasks and submit your application to Primal Torntusk: Exterminate Vilebranch Berserkers. Exterminate Vilebranch Shadow Hunters. Exterminate Vilebranch Blood Drinkers. Exterminate Vilebranch Soul Eaters.

column1: The Treasure of the Shen'dralar^60^Horde^Dire Maul^Shen'dralar Ancient^Treasure of the Shen'dralar^The Madness Within^^^Return to the Athenaeum and find the Treasure of the Shen'dralar. Claim your reward!^In the library
column2: Athenaeum
column3: you will find an ancient chest hidden beneath the stairway. Take from it that which you desire.

column1: The Darkmoon Faire^6^Alliance^Ironforge^Melnan Darkstone^Gelvas Grimegate^^^^Deliver the Free Ticket Voucher to Gelvas Grimgate
column2: located inside the Darkmoon Faire carnival.^The Darkmoon Faire is coming! Be sure to experience all the wonders and excitement of it when it comes to town! If you act right now
column3: you can redeem this voucher for free prize tickets! Just hand your voucher to Gelvas Grimgate located inside the carnival. Right now
column4: the Faire is outside Goldshire
column5: in the Elwynn Forest. Don't miss out! Go today!

column1: The Darkmoon Faire^6^All^Orgrimmar^Kruban Darkblade^Gelvas Grimegate^^^^Deliver the Free Ticket Voucher to Gelvas Grimgate
column2: located inside the Darkmoon Faire carnival.^The Darkmoon Faire is coming! Be sure to experience all the wonders and excitement of it when it comes to town! If you act right now
column3: you can redeem this voucher for free prize tickets! Just hand your voucher to Gelvas Grimgate located inside the carnival. Right now
column4: the Faire is just outside Thunder Bluff
column5: in Mulgore. Don't miss out! Go today!

column1: Paragons of Power: The Freethinker's Armguards^60^All^Paladin^Jin'rokh the Breaker^Jin'rokh the Breaker^^^^Bring Jin'rokh the Breaker Primal Hakkari Bindings. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Friendly with the Zandalar Tribe.^You are a heathen. Heathens have a place in the tribe. Heathens are freethinkers of Zandalar. Freethinkers do not fear oppression. Freethinkers die for what they believe in. We know you would die for what you believe in. This earns our acknowledgement. This earns you a chance to prove yourself further. We must have the Paragons of Power. Go to Zul'Gurub. Kill the minions of Hakkar. Return when you have what I seek. Claim the first battle gear of a Zandalar freethinker. Go.

Paragons of Power: The Freethinker's Belt^60^All^Paladin^Jin'rokh the Breaker^Jin'rokh the Breaker^^^^Bring Jin'rokh the Breaker a Primal Hakkari Shawl. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Honored with the Zandalar Tribe.^Your beliefs are alien to us
column2: heathen. Ancient Zandalar were once branded as heretics. This was when the Gurubashi Empire was strong. Heathens dared to challenge the priest of Hakkar. Heathens then were hunted and killed as vermin. Those heathens never wavered in their fight against the Blood God. We honor the price they paid. They are the freethinkers. Destroy the minions of Hakkar in Zul'Gurub. Bring me the Paragons of Power I seek. Success will be greatly rewarded. Go.

column1: Paragons of Power: The Freethinker's Breastplate^60^All^Paladin^Jin'rokh the Breaker^Jin'rokh the Breaker^^^^Bring Jin'rokh the Breaker a Primal Hakkari Tabard. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Revered with the Zandalar Tribe.^Battle gear gives you power in the tribe. The freethinkers are honored in this way. They are zealots. They imbue their breastplates with powerful mojo. If their beliefs falter in the face of the enemy
column2: their breastplate will not. You must be revered amongst us to possess such a breastplate. Go to Zul'Gurub. Take the Paragons of Power I need. Take the Paragons most painfully from the fools inside. Bring them to me. Prove your worth as a freethinker once and for all.

column1: Paragons of Power: The Augur's Bracers^60^All^Shaman^Maywiki of Zuldazar^Maywiki of Zuldazar^^^^Bring Maywiki of Zuldazar a Primal Hakkari Armsplint. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Friendly with the Zandalar Tribe.^The augurs of our tribe are revered for their gifts of the divine sight
column2: ya mon. They ain't a witch doctor; they spend their time castin' bones or readin' the leaves for insight - not hexin' people. As a shaman
column3: you already know somethin' about the power of augury; we Zandalar prize the insight they give to the tribe. Bring me an offerin' of the Paragons of Power from inside Zul'Gurub and prove your worth to us. Do this for us
column4: and I'll give ya some bracers that our augurs prize above all others!

column1: Paragons of Power: The Haruspex's Bracers^60^All^Druid^Maywiki of Zuldazar^Maywiki of Zuldazar^^^^Bring Maywiki of Zuldazar a Primal Hakkari Stanchion. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Friendly with the Zandalar Tribe.^A haruspex is a key member of our tribe; you'll be wise to listen to their portents. By communion with animals and givin' them up to the spirits when needed
column2: they give us divine guidance. In times past
column3: the haruspex's insight and wisdom gave us an edge in the wars against the splintered tribes of the Gurubashi. Bring me an offerin' of the Paragons of Power from inside Zul'Gurub and prove your worth to us. Do this
column4: and I'll give ya bracers that any haruspex of the Zandalar would want.

column1: Paragons of Power: The Vindicator's Armguards^60^All^Warrior^Jin'rokh the Breaker^Jin'rokh the Breaker^^^^Bring Jin'rokh the Breaker a Primal Hakkari Armsplint. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Friendly with the Zandalar Tribe.^Vengeance is power. The Zandalar vindicator is such power. The tribe has many enemies. The vindicator exacts retribution on them. No crime against us is unpunished. The vindicator delivers this punishment. Our enemies fear our vengeance. They should. They forever will. Become one of our vindicators. Seek the Paragons of Power inside Zul'Gurub. Slay the minions of Hakkar and claim vengeance in the tribe's name. You will be rewarded.

Paragons of Power: The Demoniac's Wraps^60^All^Warlock^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^^^^Bring Al'tabim the All-Seeing a Primal Hakkari Stanchion. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Friendly with the Zandalar Tribe.^Warlocks tread dangerous ground in dealing with demons
column2: but our demoniacs take this one step further. Through an ancient and arcane ritual
column3: they allow a demon to enter their being. Rather than let it possess them though
column4: they enslave the demon from the inside
column5: absorbing the power of the beast for their own command. It is a feat few are ever able to master. For you to learn of the power of the demoniac
column6: I must have Paragons of Power from Zul'Gurub. Go there and retrieve that which we seek.

column1: Paragons of Power: The Illusionist's Wraps^60^All^Mage^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^^^^Bring Al'tabim the All-Seeing Primal Hakkari Bindings. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Friendly with the Zandalar Tribe.^Mages in our tribe are known as illusionists. They employ powerful mojo in their incantations
column2: often befuddling and confusing the tribe's enemies! <Al'tabim laughs wickedly.> It is quite the sight to see a powerful illusionist at work
column3: bringing our enemies to their knees from their own madness! For you to know the way of our illusionists
column4: go to Zul'Gurub and bring back to me selected Paragons of Power. For this
column5: I will give you arm wraps our illusionists use to weave their spells.

column1: Paragons of Power: The Confessor's Wraps^60^All^Priest^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^^^^Bring Al'tabim the All-Seeing a Primal Hakkari Stanchion. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Friendly with the Zandalar Tribe.^We Zandalar invest power in those who speak with the authority of divinity. Our priests are more than just healers - they are our confessors. Evil comes both from outside threats - such as Hakkar - and from within the tribe. Our confessors act as the judges amongst us
column2: preserving us from the same evil that devoured the Gurubashi from inside itself. Go to Zul'Gurub and bring back the Paragons of Power from the Gurubashi. Learn what it means to be the confessor
column3: and preserve us from evil.

column1: Paragons of Power: The Predator's Bracers^60^All^Hunter^Falthir the Sightless^Falthir the Sightless^^^^Bring the following Paragons of Power from Zul'Gurub to Falthir the Sightless: A Primal Hakkari Bindings. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Friendly with the Zandalar Tribe.^In the dark times after the fall of the Gurubashi Empire
column2: Zandalar predators used their prowess to provide sustenance for the tribe. Hunters claim to be much like our tribe's predators - to seek the hunt is to embody the essence of the predator
column3: yes. Your hunt in Zul'Gurub
column4: however
column5: will show us how you truly rate amongst our finest predators. Bring to me a sampling of the Paragons of Power from within Zul'Gurub. Do so
column6: and you'll take first steps in becoming the penultimate predator.

column1: Paragons of Power: The Madcap's Bracers^60^All^Rogue^Falthir the Sightless^Falthir the Sightless^^^^Bring Falthir the Sightless a Primal Hakkari Armsplint. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Friendly with the Zandalar Tribe.^The madcaps of Zandalar are similar to rogues
column2: but above all else they embrace madness... chaos... the unpredictability of existence. A terror to behold on the battlefield
column3: they sowed the seeds of confusion and mayhem amongst our enemies in the savage times after the tribes splintered. We would not be here today without them. Bring to me the Paragons of Power from Zul'Gurub that I seek
column4: and I will grant you the first of the madcap's prized armors. Embrace the madness!

column1: Paragons of Power: The Haruspex's Belt^60^All^Druid^Maywiki of Zuldazar^Maywiki of Zuldazar^^^^Bring Maywiki of Zuldazar a Primal Hakkari Sash. Maywiki of Zuldazar is located on Yojamba Isle
column2: Stranglethorn Vale. You must also be Honored with Zandalar.^We Zandalar know not of druidic ways; nature is to be shaped by our need
column3: not the other way around. Still
column4: a haruspex is the one of us most in tune with nature
column5: and rightly so. To give up the ghost of a beastie is to know what it is to be one of them. That is the real power of nature. Bring me an offerin' of the Paragons of Power from inside Zul'Gurub
column6: proving yourself to us. Do this
column7: and I'll give ya a powerful item - a belt used by many of the Zandalar's haruspices. Strong mojo
column8: ya mon!

column1: Paragons of Power: The Haruspex's Tunic^60^All^Druid^Maywiki of Zuldazar^Maywiki of Zuldazar^^^^Bring Maywiki of Zuldazar a Primal Hakkari Tabard. Maywiki of Zuldazar is located on Yojamba Isle
column2: Stranglethorn Vale. You must also be Revered with Zandalar.^The ultimate symbol of a haruspex's power is what they wear
column3: <name>. Of these
column4: the tunic symbolizes the connection between themselves and the divine wisdom they seek. It often weaves parts of the beasties they sacrifice into the tunic; this reminds them of the connection they have to their gifts. Bring me an offerin' of the Paragons of Power from inside Zul'Gurub and prove your worth to us. Do this
column5: and a tunic seeping with the true power of a haruspex is yours.

column1: Paragons of Power: The Predator's Belt^60^All^Hunter^Falthir the Sightless^Falthir the Sightless^^^^Bring the following Paragons of Power from Zul'Gurub to Falthir the Sightless: A Primal Hakkari Shawl. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Honored with the Zandalar Tribe.^A predator knows how to stalk their prey
column2: but a successful one knows how to strike at it once they have closed ranks. You must master both to have any chance of success in Zul'Gurub... and any chance of being like the Zandalar predators. Bring me choice parts of the Paragons of Power from within Zul'Gurub. My reward will be the power that the trinkets yield
column3: while yours will be the Zandalar predator's belt - equipment well worth the trade.

column1: Paragons of Power: The Predator's Mantle^60^All^Hunter^Falthir the Sightless^Falthir the Sightless^^^^Bring the following Paragons of Power from Zul'Gurub to Falthir the Sightless: A Primal Hakkari Aegis. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Revered with the Zandalar Tribe.^We Zandalar prize what we wear as a symbol of accomplishment. You don't need to be able to see what one wears to be able to sense what emanates from it - power transcends sight. The garments of the Zandalar predator are like this
column2: and most cherished by them is the mantle they wear. It helps to obfuscate them from view... and to make their presence known when they wish it. The Paragons of Power await your retrieval in Zul'Gurub. Bring me what I seek
column3: and the predator's mantle shall be yours.

column1: Paragons of Power: The Illusionist's Mantle^60^All^Mage^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^^^^Bring Al'tabim the All-Seeing a Primal Hakkari Shawl. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Honored with the Zandalar Tribe.^Magic is a raw
column2: primal force to be shaped by those strong enough to do it. Mojo is our extension of this power; one such potent manipulation of it is in the form of illusion. How can one truly hope to win against a foe that is not even really there? We Zandalar know the power of this
column3: and as such illusionists hold a honored place within the tribe. Take the needed Paragons of Power from Zul'Gurub - for this
column4: honor from the tribe and a powerful mantle used by our best illusionists will be yours!

column1: Paragons of Power: The Illusionist's Robes^60^All^Mage^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^^^^Bring Al'tabim the All-Seeing a Primal Hakkari Kossack. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Revered with the Zandalar Tribe.^The tribe acknowledges station and power through what we wear. Our vestments are made from the finest of materials
column2: and interwoven with the mojo we use to make us powerful. Illusionists are no exception; their robes are said to embody the essence of illusion in their look. Legend states that their ancient robes never looked the same twice. I will give you an illusionist's robe
column3: <name>... but earn your place of reverence among the tribe first! Bring me the Paragons of Power from Zul'Gurub!

column1: Paragons of Power: The Confessor's Bindings^60^All^Priest^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^^^^Bring Al'tabim the All-Seeing a Primal Hakkari Sash. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Honored with the Zandalar Tribe.^Shortly after the fall of the Gurubashi
column2: we Zandalar almost succumbed to a final defeat from evil within our own tribe. It was then that the confessors amongst us arose
column3: preserving the tribe by banishing out those who would destroy their own kind. They not only keep us in tune with the spirits
column4: but they also preserve the flesh. Go forth into Zul'Gurub and witness first hand the depravity of Hakkar and the Gurubashi. Wrest the Paragons of Power that we seek from them; success will be rewarded!

column1: Paragons of Power: The Confessor's Mantle^60^All^Priest^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^^^^Bring Al'tabim the All-Seeing a Primal Hakkari Aegis. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Revered with the Zandalar Tribe.^The confessors of the Zandalar all wear a distinctive mantle
column2: marking them as the preservers of the tribe. These mantles are woven with powerful mojo that aids them in judging those who would threaten our tribe. As a priest
column3: you too must spend your time judging those worthy and not; such a mantle would definitely be a blessing to you. In exchange for fighting Hakkar's minions in Zul'Gurub and bringing me the Paragons of Power I seek
column4: I will give you a mantle worthy of our finest confessors.

column1: Paragons of Power: The Madcap's Mantle^60^All^Rogue^Falthir the Sightless^Falthir the Sightless^^^^Bring Falthir the Sightless a Primal Hakkari Girdle. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Honored with the Zandalar Tribe.^One of Zandalar's legendary madcaps was Khar'vaxal the Cracked. Legend states that when facing the enemies of the tribe for the first time
column2: Kar'xavan used his mantle specifically woven with "the weave of madness". His form was shrouded not only by the mantle
column3: but also with the blinding speed of his twin daggers. Madcaps today cherish their mantle as a sign of their place in the tribe. Bring to me the Paragons of Power I seek
column4: and such a mantle will be yours to weave madness unto your own enemies.

column1: Paragons of Power: The Madcap's Tunic^60^All^Rogue^Falthir the Sightless^Falthir the Sightless^^^^Bring Falthir the Sightless a Primal Hakkari Aegis. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Revered with the Zandalar Tribe.^My eyes failed me long ago
column2: but I do not miss them. Even in a tribe such as ours - where one's vestments convey station and purpose - the most potent of garb exudes power that simple eyes cannot see. The prized tunic of the Zandalar madcap is no exception
column3: exuding the raw power of chaos and madness that they are able to channel. The Paragons of Power I need lie in Zul'Gurub; bring me what I seek
column4: and I will reward you with your own legendary tunic... one befitting a weaver of madness.

column1: Paragons of Power: The Augur's Belt^60^All^Shaman^Maywiki of Zuldazar^Maywiki of Zuldazar^^^^Bring Maywiki of Zuldazar a Primal Hakkari Girdle. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Honored with the Zandalar Tribe.^Augurs know the mojo of the elements
column2: mon. They use it as a means to guide the tribe to glory. In the dark days after the Gurubashi Empire ripped itself up
column3: our augurs led us to our safe haven in the South Seas. They've also led us back here to the Vale
column4: right back to the heart of evil brewin' in Zul'Gurub. Bring me an offerin' of the Paragons of Power from inside Zul'Gurub and prove your worth to us. Do it and I'll give ya a belt that our augurs use - one with powerful mojo inside it!

column1: Paragons of Power: The Augur's Hauberk^60^All^Shaman^Maywiki of Zuldazar^Maywiki of Zuldazar^^^^Bring Maywiki of Zuldazar a Primal Hakkari Tabard. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Revered with the Zandalar Tribe.^The augurs of the Zandalar all wear a distinctive chest piece called a hauberk. It's fitted with the finest of silks and cloths
column2: interwoven with strong chain. It's a symbol of not only their divinity
column3: but also of their authority
column4: mon. It's never wise to cross one whose life is devoted to speakin' with the spirits... Bring me an offerin' of the Paragons of Power from inside Zul'Gurub and prove your worth to us. Do it and I'll give ya one of the finest hauberks our augurs would ever hope to wear!

column1: Paragons of Power: The Demoniac's Mantle^60^All^Warlock^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^^^^Bring Al'tabim the All-Seeing a Primal Hakkari Sash. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Honored with the Zandalar Tribe.^The demoniac seeks to embody power outright
column2: not just possess it. More than one of our demoniacs has lost a fight with a demon; with our enemies threatening us - especially in Zul'Gurub - the power that a demoniac is able to unleash on our foes is worth the sacrifice. Our survival depends on crushing those who would destroy us; the fall of the Gurubashi Empire taught us this. Travel to Zul'Gurub and gain the Paragons of Power we need. Do this
column3: and a valuable demoniac item shall be yours.

column1: Paragons of Power: The Demoniac's Robes^60^All^Warlock^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^Al'tabim the All-Seeing^^^^Bring Al'tabim the All-Seeing a Primal Hakkari Kossack. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Revered with the Zandalar Tribe.^The ultimate symbol of power amongst the tribe is the garb we wear in battle. A demoniac's robes have fused fine runecloth and devastatingly powerful mojo into a single fabric. The visage of the robe is said to instill fear into the minds of all who see it... especially the demons that the demoniac will eventually dominate. From Zul'Gurub
column2: you must bring me a very specific set of the Paragons of Power. It will be difficult... but your success will assure you of acquiring a robe for yourself.

column1: Paragons of Power: The Vindicator's Belt^60^All^Warrior^Jin'rokh the Breaker^Jin'rokh the Breaker^^^^Bring Jin'rokh the Breaker a Primal Hakkari Girdle. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Honored with the Zandalar Tribe.^The ultimate vengeance waits within Zul'Gurub. Hakkar must not rise again. Hakkar destroyed the Gurubashi Empire from within. No sacrifice was enough. The trolls are a shadow of former glories. I know this is because of Hakkar. Become the vindicator you were meant to be. Wreak havoc on the minions of evil. Zul'Gurub must taste Zandalar vengeance. Bring me proof in the Paragons of Power. You will receive the vindicator's belt. You will receive real power. Go.

Paragons of Power: The Vindicator's Breastplate^60^All^Warrior^Jin'rokh the Breaker^Jin'rokh the Breaker^^^^Bring Jin'rokh the Breaker a Primal Hakkari Kossack. You must also have a reputation equal to or greater than Revered with the Zandalar Tribe.^The vindicator's symbol of power is the breastplate. It is forged with powerful mojo. It is trusted only to those we revere. It is the Zandalar symbol of vengeance. To become a vindicator is to become vengeance. Take the Paragons of Power we need from Zul'Gurub. Bring them to us. We will take the mojo stolen from us. We will make the minions of Hakkar pay. We will reward you with the vindicator's breastplate. Go. Be our vengeance
column2: <name>.

column1: Arathi Basin Resources!^55^Alliance^Arathi Basin^Sergeant Maclear^Sergeant Maclear^^^More Resource Crates^Win the battle for Arathi Basin
column2: get an Arathi Resource Crate
column3: and return it to Sergeant Maclear at Refuge Pointe.^War must be fought with soldiers
column4: any soldier will tell you. They'll also say that a battle fought with poor gear or on an empty stomach is lost before it starts! That is why Arathi Basin is important. There are key areas in the basin that hold essential resources. Metals
column5: weapons
column6: food
column7: lumber - all are needed
column8: and all can be gained there. That is what I want from you
column9: <name>. Enter Arathi Basin
column10: win the battle by holding more bases than the enemy
column11: and return to me with a crate of resources.

column1: The Battle for Arathi Basin!^55^Alliance^Arathi Basin^Field Marshal Oslight^Field Marshal Oslight^^^^Assault the mine
column2: the lumber mill
column3: the blacksmith and the farm
column4: then return to Field Marshal Oslight in Refuge Pointe.^<name>
column5: the battle for Arathi Basin is a battle for resources and territory. Key points in the area must be held and operated in order to supply our forces with much needed raw materials and supplies. I charge you to assault the points farthest from our Arathi Basin base. Assault the farm
column6: the mine
column7: the lumber mill and the blacksmith when they are controlled by the enemy. Find the enemy's banner and rip it from its flag post! When you have done this to all four points
column8: return to me.

column1: Control Four Bases^60^Alliance^Arathi Basin^Field Marshal Oslight^Field Marshal Oslight^^^^Enter Arathi Basin
column2: capture and control four bases at the same time
column3: and then return to Field Marshal Oslight at Refuge Pointe.^<name>
column4: you have taken the battle of Arathi Basin to our enemies and earned great honors in that field of battle. You have shown us your worth as a <class>
column5: and you have shown our enemies that we will not submit to their villainy! Because of your proven value to us
column6: I have a difficult task for you. I want you to take and hold at least four of the bases in Arathi Basin. If you can do that
column7: then we will not only secure critical resources
column8: we will show the Horde our dominance! Go
column9: <name>
column10: and good fortune.

column1: Control Five Bases^60^Alliance^Arathi Basin^Field Marshal Oslight^Field Marshal Oslight^^^^Control 5 bases in Arathi Basin at the same time
column2: then return to Field Marshal Oslight at Refuge Pointe.^<name>
column3: battling for the resources of Arathi Basin is a bloody undertaking. Your services to the League of Arathor are as needed as they are appreciated. And we have one more task for you. The League wishes to make one strong push against the Defilers' occupation of Arathi Basin. We want them driven out of every strategic point on the battlefield! It will not be easy
column4: but if anyone can get it done
column5: it is you.

column1: The Battle for Arathi Basin!^55^Horde^Arathi Basin^Deathmaster Dwire^Deathmaster Dwire^^^^Assault the Arathi Basin mine
column2: lumber mill
column3: blacksmith and stable
column4: and then return to Deathmaster Dwire in Hammerfall.^As you no doubt have heard
column5: the League of Arathor is sending large numbers of troops into Arathi Basin. Eager for food and supplies
column6: these Alliance fools are intent to take and control the rich resources there. We must show them that Arathi will never again be a home for humans! Go to Arathi Basin and assault the mine
column7: the lumber mill
column8: the blacksmith and the stables. Pull down the enemies' banners
column9: declaring those territories for the Horde. Go
column10: <name>. Report back to me when this task is complete.

column1: Take Four Bases^60^Horde^Arathi Basin^Deathmaster Dwire^Deathmaster Dwire^^^^Hold four bases at the same time in Arathi Basin
column2: and then return to Deathmaster Dwire in Hammerfall.^<name>
column3: as the battles over Arathi Basin rage
column4: news of your actions have reached many ears. You are highly regarded among us
column5: which gives me confidence that you will accomplish the mission I now have for you. It is time to send a message to the League of Arathor. We must show them that their holdings in Arathi Basin are tenuous and quickly lost. We will show them this by holding
column6: all at once
column7: four strategic points in Arathi Basin. Succeed in this
column8: <name>
column9: and earn great respect among the Defilers.

column1: Take Five Bases^60^Horde^Arathi Basin^Deathmaster Dwire^Deathmaster Dwire^^^^Hold five bases in Arathi Basin at the same time
column2: then return to Deathmaster Dwire in Hammerfall.^It is difficult to see
column3: so deep we are in the conflict
column4: but our spies report a weakening in the League of Arathor's resolve. We must use this window and strike a brutal blow against them! Return to Arathi Basin and throw yourself against our foes. Curse them and kill them and control all five strategic bases! Send their soldiers screaming and bleeding from the front lines
column5: with stories of your cruelty on their mewling lips. Do this
column6: and score a great victory for the Defilers.

column1: Cut Arathor Supply Lines^55^Horde^Arathi Basin^Deathstalker Mortis^Deathstalker Mortis^^^More Resource Crates^Win the battle for Arathi Basin
column2: get an Arathi Resource Crate
column3: and return it to Deathstalker Mortis at Hammerfall.^The League of Arathor is sparing no expense in their move to retake Arathi. They
column4: and all the races of the Alliance
column5: now stream to this distant region
column6: intent on expanding their hold from Refuge Pointe. We must stop them
column7: and the best means to stop them is to take their supplies. You can help us
column8: <name>. Enter Arathi Basin
column9: known for its rich mines
column10: fertile land and skilled craftsman. Capture and control every base you can
column11: win the battle
column12: and return to me with the resources you gain.

column1: The Hunter's Charm^52^All^Hunter^Kary Thunderhorn^Ogtinc^REUSE^^^Speak to Ogtinc in Azshara.^Ogtinc of Azshara has sent out a call for seasoned hunters such as yourself. He is a furbolg hunter who has left his tribe to aid the Cenarion Circle. His teachings are meant to enrich the wisdom of others who share his craft
column2: and guide them toward maintaining a balance. You would do well to speak with him. Ogtinc resides atop the cliffs of Azshara
column3: northeast from the Ruins of Eldarath.

column1: Courser Antlers^52^All^Hunter^Ogtinc^Ogtinc^REUSE^^^Bring a pair of Perfect Courser Antlers to Ogtinc in Azshara. Ogtinc resides atop the cliffs northeast of the Ruins of Eldarath.^The courser wears the mightiest antlers in the known lands. Such antlers are used to defend the courser
column2: goring an attacker and often damaging the points. Perfect
column3: natural antlers are the sign of an animal spirit with supreme confidence. To hold such antlers will bestow the same confidence in you. Hunt the mosshoof courser
column4: find the perfect antlers and bring them to me.

column1: Confront Yeh'kinya^58^All^Tanaris^Prospector Ironboot^Yeh'kinya^^The Final Tablets^The Hand of Rastakhan^Speak with Yeh'kinya.^My delvings into the Mosh'aru Tablets bear grim news
column2: <name>. Hakkar's true form
column3: the god himself
column4: can be born again through the very egg into which you captured him. Yeh'kinya told you it was to contain his evil
column5: but it is to recreate it! The troll has led you astray! Go to Yeh'kinya and demand the egg from him. Pray that it is not too late to stop Hakkar's return!

column1: The Hand of Rastakhan^58^All^Tanaris^Prospector Ironboot^Molthor^^Confront Yeh'kinya^^Speak with Molthor in Stranglethorn.^<name>
column2: our worst fears have come. Legend speaks of the Soulflayer ruling the ancient troll world through evil and terror
column3: and his power was absolute. If he cannot be stopped now
column4: then his new reign may spread across all of Azeroth! There is a contingent of Zandalarian trolls who may help us stem this tide of darkness. They have camped on Yojamba Isle
column5: off the coast of Stranglethorn
column6: west of the ruins of Zul'Kunda. Speak with their leader
column7: Molthor
column8: and pray he knows how to defeat Hakkar.

column1: The Heart of Hakkar^60^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Heart of Hakkar^Molthor^^^^Bring the Heart of Hakkar to Molthor on Yojamba Isle.^The Heart of Hakkar burns from within. Although the Soulflayer is defeated
column2: the kernel of his power yet remains in this cursed organ.

column1: A Collection of Heads^60^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Exzhal^Exzhal^^^^String 5 Channeler's Heads
column2: then return the Collection of Troll Heads to Exzhal on Yojamba Isle.^It is true. Hakkar now dwells in Zul'Gurub
column3: bathing in the power of our gods. Enthralled high priests now channel the energies of our most sacred divinities into the Soulflayer
column4: who will soon have a strength beyond any being of Azeroth. He must be stopped! Take this sacred cord
column5: and string through it the heads of the high priests responsible for channeling our gods' energy. When you have done this
column6: return to me.

column1: Nat's Measuring Tape^60^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Battered Tackle Box^Nat Pagle^^^^Return Nat's Measuring Tape to Nat Pagle in Dustwallow Marsh.^Amongst the shattered fishing lures and tackle is a rolled
column2: silken measuring tape. Attached to the tape is a label that reads: "Nat Pagle
column3: Dustwallow Marsh."

column1: Wavethrashing^52^All^Hunter^Ogtinc^Ogtinc^REUSE^^^Bring 6 Wavethrasher Scales to Ogtinc in Azshara. Ogtinc resides atop the cliffs northeast the Ruins of Eldarath.^The wavethrasher is an amphibious beast living only here in Azshara. They are powerful and resilient. The tough
column2: reflective scales from a wavethrasher mirror the strength of the hunter. Track and hunt wavethrashers along the coast of Azshara
column3: and bring me their scales.

column1: The Green Drake^52^All^Hunter^Ogtinc^Ogtinc^REUSE^^^Bring the Tooth of Morphaz to Ogtinc in Azshara. Ogtinc resides atop the cliffs northeast the Ruins of Eldarath.^Now I set you on a dangerous hunt to slay the green drake
column2: Morphaz
column3: and bring his tooth to me. Morphaz dwells deep in Temple of Atal'Hakkar
column4: the entrance to which lies in Swamp of Sorrows. If you wish to defeat him
column5: you must not go alone. This drake is an enemy of many -- seek others who wish to destroy him. The drake's tooth represents the power a hunter will find in the company of others. Bring it to me and you will have learned much.

column1: A Simple Request^52^All^Rogue^Osborne the Night Man^Lord Jorach Ravenholdt^A Simple Request^^^Speak with Lord Jorach Ravenholdt in Ravenholdt Manor.^Lord Jorach Ravenholdt has requested your presence. The matter is secret
column2: and I cannot say any more. Ravenholdt Manor is located in the Hillsbrad Foothills -- look for a path in the mountains northwest of Durnhold Keep.

column1: Sealed Azure Bag^52^All^Rogue^Lord Jorach Ravenholdt^Archmage Xylem^A Simple Request^^^Retrieve the Sealed Azure Bag from the Timbermaw Shaman in Azshara. Then take the bag to Archmage Xylem
column2: also found in Azshara.^First things first. What I've lost is a small blue bag
column3: the contents of which are a private matter. Don't bother going after the thieves
column4: because they are already dead. What we do know is the fools couldn't get the bag open. so they sold it to some timbermaw shaman in Azshara as a holy relic. Clever. I need you to travel to Azshara and retrieve it from the shaman through subtlety... or force. Better luck with the first method
column5: I'd wager. Once acquired
column6: take it to Archmage Xylem.

column1: Encoded Fragments^52^All^Rogue^Archmage Xylem^Archmage Xylem^A Simple Request^^^Bring 10 Encoded Fragments to Archmage Xylem in Azshara.^Lord Ravenholdt has asked a favor of us both. He wishes to remove the enchantment from this bag. Unfortunately
column2: some of my books on the subject of dispelling were taken recently
column3: only to be destroyed by savages. The remains of my books are still valuable to me. If you can bring me enough of the encoded fragments
column4: I can piece them back together. Your best chance is to kill the beasts of Azshara
column5: since they have a tendency to pick up just about anything.

column1: The Azure Key^52^All^Rogue^Archmage Xylem^Lord Jorach Ravenholdt^A Simple Request^^^Return the Azure Key to Lord Jorach Ravenholdt.^It will take some time to decipher the fragments and remove the enchantment. When I am complete
column2: I'll deliver the bag to Lord Ravenholdt personally. There is still the matter of the key
column3: said to be held by a green drake known as Morphaz. The drake has made its home deep in the Temple of Atal'Hakkar
column4: the entrance to which lies in the Swamp of Sorrows. Gather your friends and venture to his lair. Lord Ravenholdt will await your return with the key.

column1: A Bijou for Zanza^60^All^Stranglethorn Vale^Vinchaxa^Vinchaxa^^^^Destroy any one of the Hakkari Bijous found in Zul'Gurub at the Altar of Zanza on Yojamba Isle. When done
column2: speak with Vinchaxa nearby.^The destruction of the various Hakkari Bijous is of grave importance to us
column3: so much so that we welcome outsiders of the tribe to do so for themselves! Take any one of the bijous that you find in Zul'Gurub to the Altar of Zanza and destroy it. For this one time alone
column4: I will give you an additional Honor Token from our tribe; this is above and beyond what you would normally receive. Witness for yourself the blessings of Zanza!

column1: Magecraft^52^All^Mage^Archmage Shymm^Sanath Lim-yo^^^Magic Dust^Seek out Sanath Lim-yo and gain passage to see Archmage Xylem.^Archmage Xylem has been asking around lately... for someone of your experience. If you wish to seek him out
column2: you can find him in Azshara. His tower is built high atop the cliffs
column3: and the only way up is a teleport spell invoked by his arrogant servant
column4: Sanath Lim-yo. Sanath makes camp below his master's tower. To find him
column5: travel to where Azshara's main road forks at the entrance to the Ruins of Eldarath. From that spot
column6: head directly north until you reach the cliffs.

column1: Magic Dust^52^All^Mage^Archmage Xylem^Archmage Xylem^Magic Dust^Magecraft^^Bring 10 Glittering Dust to Archmage Xylem.^The blood elves in Azshara have developed a method for pulverizing the magical items they acquire. This glittering dust they produce differs from the components normally acquired by a disenchantment spell. When I sent my apprentice to trade for the dust
column2: he was killed without hesitation. For that
column3: they must pay. The time for talk is over
column4: <name>. Find the blood elves along the cliffs of Azshara and use more "persuasive" methods to acquire their glittering dust.

column1: The Siren's Coral^52^All^Mage^Archmage Xylem^Archmage Xylem^Magic Dust^^^Collect 6 Enchanted Coral and return them to Archmage Xylem.^Take a look around you. The ruins and beaches are overrun with spitelash. Recently
column2: the wretched creatures have learned to recognize the rare components indigenous to Azshara. Specifically
column3: I speak of enchanted coral -- they are drawn to it by reasons unknown to me. Now there is little coral left in the bay
column4: and it is vital to my research. I need you to separate some enchanted coral from the spitelash sirens and bring it to me.

column1: Destroy Morphaz^52^All^Mage^Archmage Xylem^Archmage Xylem^Magic Dust^^^Retrieve the Arcane Shard from Morphaz and return to Archmage Xylem.^There is a green drake deep in the sunken temple of Atal'Hakkar by the name of Morphaz. Years ago
column2: he overwhelmed me in a bold ambush and consumed my apprentice whole. While the loss of an apprentice is not unknown to me
column3: this particular one carried an arcane shard of unsurpassed size and quality. You must gather powerful allies and delve into the temple. Destroy Morphaz and recover the arcane shard from his ageless stomach.

column1: Cenarion Aid^52^All^Priest^High Priestess Laurena^Ogtinc^Cenarion Aid^^^Seek out Ogtinc in Azshara.^It is the way of the divine to help those in need. The how is insignificant -- only the why matters. The Cenarion Circle has such a need. Speak with Ogtinc to lend aid to their plight. He resides atop the cliffs to the northeast of the Ruins of Eldarath in Azshara.

Of Coursers We Know^52^All^Priest^Ogtinc^Ogtinc^Cenarion Aid^^^Acquire 4 Healthy Courser Glands and bring them to Ogtinc in Azshara. Ogtinc resides atop the cliffs northeast the Ruins of Eldarath.^The mosshoof coursers of Azshara are magnificent animals who once lived in Felwood. They naturally resist disease and poison
column2: and were unaffected by the corruption there. In their ancestral wisdom
column3: they simply chose to leave that sickened place. It saddens my heart
column4: but I must ask you to hunt these mighty beasts for me. Gather four courser glands as the first ingredient for a restorative salve -- a salve we will use to heal Felwood.

column1: The Ichor of Undeath^52^All^Priest^Ogtinc^Ogtinc^Cenarion Aid^^^Acquire an Ichor of Undeath for Ogtinc in Azshara. Ogtinc resides atop the cliffs northeast the Ruins of Eldarath.^For this restorative salve
column2: you must use a simple formula: one part poison
column3: two parts cure. You have acquired one cure
column4: now you must gather the poison. Powerful undead
column5: such as the lingering highborne who wander the Ruins of Eldarath
column6: are sometimes so infused with evil that it coalesces into a sickly greenish goo. To the living
column7: this substance is known as ichor of undeath. Due to the potency of this vile element
column8: I require only a single ichor.

column1: Blood of Morphaz^52^All^Priest^Ogtinc^Greta Mosshoof^Cenarion Aid^^^Kill Morphaz in the sunken temple of Atal'Hakkar
column2: and return his blood to Greta Mosshoof in Felwood. The entrance to the sunken temple can be found in the Swamp of Sorrows.^Now the last part
column3: the second cure. The green drake Morphaz is known to be immune to all forms of poison and disease -- many druids died to bring us this information. There is no doubt his blood is potent for our needs. A courier from the Cenarion Circle will take the parts you have already collected while you gather the last. Summon your allies and seek out the drake's lair in the sunken temple of Atal'Hakkar. Bring his blood to Greta Mosshoof in Felwood.

column1: The Darkreaver Menace^60^Horde^Shaman^Sagorne Creststrider^Sagorne Creststrider^Material Assistance^^^Use the Divination Scryer in the heart of the Great Ossuary's basement in the Scholomance. Doing so will bring forth spirits you must fight. Defeating these spirits will summon forth Death Knight Darkreaver; defeat him.^Death Knight Darkreaver lords over the Great Ossuary in the Scholomance. He threatens to twist the spirit realm to do his own bidding
column2: and he must be stopped! This is where the scryer you helped make comes into play. Use the divination scryer in the heart of the Great Ossuary's basement to call forth Darkreaver's spirit minions. Defeat the spirits and the death knight himself will appear. <name>
column3: bring me his head! Only his demise will reverse the damage done to the spirit realm!

column1: Taking Back Silithus^55^Alliance^Ironforge^Cenarion Emissary Jademoon^Windcaller Proudhorn^Taking Back Silithus^^^Talk to Windcaller Proudhorn at Cenarion Hold in Silithus.^Attention
column2: heroes of the Alliance! The silithid menace has been left unchecked for too long. Unfettered by any real opposition
column3: they've been preparing all this time for a large-scale expansion. Cenarion Circle forces are gathering in Silithus to take the fight to these wretched creatures and all able-bodied adventurers are hereby called to join us! Don't wait until it's too late! Aid us in the defense of Azeroth! Report to Windcaller Proudhorn at Cenarion Hold for specific instructions!

column1: Taking Back Silithus^55^Horde^Orgrimmar^Cenarion Emissary Blackhoof^Windcaller Proudhorn^Taking Back Silithus^^^Talk to Windcaller Proudhorn at Cenarion Hold in Silithus.^Attention
column2: champions of the Horde! There's a threat we've left unchallenged for too long. Tremors in the earth near silithid hives all around Azeroth have alerted us to large movements in their numbers as they prepare for expansion. Cenarion Circle forces are gathering in Silithus to take the fight to the silithid before it's too late! No more shall they defile our lands! All able-bodied combatants are to report to Windcaller Proudhorn at Cenarion Hold! The silithid shall be vanquished!

column1: Deadly Desert Venom^55^All^Silithus^Beetix Ficklespragg^Beetix Ficklespragg^^^Noggle's Last Hope^Beetix Ficklespragg at Cenarion Hold in Silithus wants you to gather 8 Stonelash Scorpid Stingers and 8 Sand Skitterer Fangs. Return to her when you have completed the task.^Beetix Ficklespragg at your service! My cousin Noggle makes a living gathering rare herbs for Cenarion Hold alchemists. Or used to
column2: anyway. He came back from his last trip with a strong poison running though his veins. I've managed to slow down the venom
column3: but to fully neutralize it I need poison samples from whatever stung him. Noggle arrived from the north
column4: so I'd bet my shirt stonelash scorpids or sand skitterers did it. Bring me some stingers and fangs and I'll try to make an antidote for him.

column1: Noggle's Last Hope^57^All^Silithus^Beetix Ficklespragg^Beetix Ficklespragg^^Deadly Desert Venom^Noggle's Lost Satchel^Beetix Ficklespragg at Cenarion Hold in Silithus wants you to gather 3 Stonelash Pincer Stingers
column2: 3 Stonelash Flayer Stingers and 3 Rock Stalker Fangs.^Blasted! The antidote didn't work. Noggle must've been stung by one of the stronger creatures in the far south. I'm going to need you to go there and get me some more samples
column3: <name>. The good news is that since their poison is stronger I won't require as many. The bad news is that there are more kinds of poisonous creatures crawling around the southern area so you'll have to draw from more sources.

column1: The Twilight Lexicon^60^All^Silithus^Hermit Ortell^Hermit Ortell^The Twilight Mystery^^True Believers^Bring the three chapters of the Twilight Lexicon to Hermit Ortell in Silithus.^The Twilight's Hammer are not kind to those that leave their ranks. They hunt me to this day like I'm some sort of beast! Needless to say
column2: an enemy of theirs is a friend of mine! To decipher this Tablet I'll need the book used by their scribes to encode secret messages: the Twilight Lexicon. It's such an important tool that they keep its three chapters in different locations! The officers entrusted with the Lexicon are known as Twilight Keepers. Look for them at the Twilight's Hammer camps.

column1: Securing the Supply Lines^55^All^Silithus^Windcaller Proudhorn^Windcaller Proudhorn^Taking Back Silithus^^^Windcaller Proudhorn at Cenarion Hold in Silithus wants you to kill 15 Dredge Strikers.^Cenarion Hold is a location of utmost strategic importance. I'm convinced that while we hold it our victory over the silithid is guaranteed. Provided our influx supplies can be maintained
column2: that is. Desert worms have proven to be more of a threat to our supply caravans than even the silithid themselves. Just this morning
column3: a large shipment of morrowgrain was ravaged by a group of dredge strikers. I need you to thin their numbers to ensure our supplies aren't jeopardized.

column1: Stepping Up Security^57^All^Silithus^Windcaller Proudhorn^Windcaller Proudhorn^Taking Back Silithus^^^Windcaller Proudhorn at Cenarion Hold in Silithus wants you to slay 20 Dredge Crushers.^Your performance has been truly exemplary so far
column2: <name>. Our supply lines are not completely safe yet
column3: however. In the absence of dredge strikers
column4: their larger southern cousins will surely move in to take their place in the north. You'll have to kill quite a few dredge crushers to keep them at bay
column5: but we cannot leave the safety of our supply lines to chance.

column1: Noggle's Lost Satchel^58^All^Silithus^Noggle Ficklespragg^Noggle Ficklespragg^^Noggle's Last Hope^^Retrieve Noggle's Satchel from the mountains in the south of Silithus and return it to him at Cenarion Hold.^Where am I? Where's my bag? *gasp* I must've lost it while fleeing from Deathclasp
column2: the giant scorpid. In my rush to escape I walked right into a nest of stonelash flayers. The satchel I was carrying had all sorts of rare reagents in it. Without them
column3: me and Beetix won't be able to make the potions that Cenarion Hold needs. I'm too weak to get up yet
column4: but I can make it worth your while if you bring back my reagents. I ran into Deathclasp in the southern mountain range
column5: behind Bronzebeard's camp.

column1: Wanted - Deathclasp
column2: Terror of the Sands^59^All^Silithus^Wanted Poster: Deathclasp^Vish Kozus^^^^Bring Deathclasp's Pincer to Vish Kozus
column3: Captain of the Guard.^The terrible scorpid
column4: Deathclasp
column5: is believed to have retreated to the southern mountain range in the presence of increased silithid activity. She presents a great threat to patrols and expeditions in the southern regions. Individuals participating in her destruction will be remunerated handsomely. Inquire with Captain Vish Kozus
column6: at the top of the Cenarion Hold Watchtower
column7: regarding a reward.

column1: The Twilight Mystery^58^All^Silithus^Geologist Larksbane^Geologist Larksbane^The Twilight Mystery^^^Geologist Larksbane at Cenarion Hold in Silithus wants you to collect 8 Twilight Tablet Fragments.^A camp of Twilight's Hammer cultists once thrived northwest of here. If you were to venture there now
column2: you'd find the area swarming with elementals and nothing but scattered pieces of wood and canvas to mark the spot where the camp was. I've recovered a few fragments of a clay tablet from the site
column3: but I have too few of them to piece together anything useful. See if you can find the remaining tablet fragments so we can shed some light into the Twilight's Hammer presence here in Silithus.

column1: The Deserter^59^All^Silithus^Geologist Larksbane^Hermit Ortell^The Twilight Mystery^^^Take the restored tablet to Hermit Ortell in Silithus.^There are rumors of a Twilight's Hammer member called Ortell having deserted his sect. Word has it he hid in the mountains south of Southwind Village
column2: where he lives as a hermit. Perhaps you can enlist his help in deciphering the tablet. Take the restored tablet with you and seek out Ortell.

column1: What Tomorrow Brings^60^All^Silithus^Baristolth of the Shifting Sands^Baristolth of the Shifting Sands^What Tomorrow Brings^^^Venture to the Caverns of Time in Tanaris and find Anachronos
column2: Brood of Nozdormu.^The embrace of death had all but overcome my being when he intervened. He breathed only once upon my maimed body and then waited patiently for the sands of time to cleanse my wounds. "Forever you will remain if you must
column3: he said, and with those words I was bound as a Watcher. Look now to the desert. The second war is upon us. You must seek out the resting place of the Bronze. Venture to the Caverns of Time and see if the master has returned. I must be sure before I am able to proceed.A Terrible Purpose^60^All^Silithus^Hermit Ortell^Commander Mar'alith^The Twilight Mystery^^^Take the Decoded Tablet Parchment to Commander Mar'alith.^Ok, here we are... a pretty valuable chunk of information, I must say! I've seen the Cenarion Circle forces arrive at Silithus. They plan to drive the Twilight's Hammer out, don't they? This will help. Take this parchment to their leader, Commander Mar'alith. Soon the Twilight's Hammer will be vanquished and I will be outside their grasp for good!Only One May Rise^60^All^Blackwing Lair^Baristolth of the Shifting Sands^Baristolth of the Shifting Sands^What Tomorrow Brings^^^Return the Head of the Broodlord Lashlayer to Baristolth of the Shifting Sands at Cenarion Hold in Silithus.^There is no time to waste! A hero must be found! The task I give will require an army to complete but only one may rise from the throng of would be champions to take on the burden and responsibility of an ally of the Brood. Within the lair of the Lord of Blackrock is a most cruel beast. The Broodlord Lashlayer guards the Halls of Strife, blocking the way into Nefarian's inner sanctum. Slay the foul aberration and return his head to me. Do this and you may begin the next step of your journey.Arathi Basin Resources!^60^Alliance^Arathi Basin^Sergeant Maclear^Sergeant Maclear^^^More Resource Crates, More Resource Crates^Win the battle for Arathi Basin, get an Arathi Resource Crate, and return it to Sergeant Maclear at Refuge Pointe.^War must be fought with soldiers, any soldier will tell you. They'll also say that a battle fought with poor gear or on an empty stomach is lost before it starts! That is why Arathi Basin is important. There are key areas in the basin that hold essential resources. Metals, weapons, food, lumber - all are needed, and all can be gained there. That is what I want from you, <name>. Enter Arathi Basin, win the battle by holding more bases than the enemy, and return to me with a crate of resources.Cut Arathor Supply Lines^60^Horde^Arathi Basin^Deathstalker Mortis^Deathstalker Mortis^^^More Resource Crates, More Resource Crates^Win the battle for Arathi Basin, get an Arathi Resource Crate, and return it to Deathstalker Mortis at Hammerfall.^The League of Arathor is sparing no expense in their move to retake Arathi. They, and all the races of the Alliance, now stream to this distant region, intent on expanding their hold from Refuge Pointe. We must stop them, and the best means to stop them is to take their supplies. You can help us, <name>. Enter Arathi Basin, known for its rich mines, fertile land and skilled craftsman. Capture and control every base you can, win the battle, and return to me with the resources you gain.The Path of the Righteous^60^All^Silithus^Baristolth of the Shifting Sands^Baristolth of the Shifting Sands^What Tomorrow Brings^^The Hand of the Righteous, Anachronos^Collect 200 Silithid Carapace Fragments and return to Baristolth.^The Brood of Nozdormu are naturally distrusting of the lesser races. While it is true that you have proven to me that you have the potential makings of a hero, the time has come to prove this to my master. Hive'Ashi, Hive'Zora, Hive'Regal: All swarming with activity and all a threat to our existence. Slay silithid at these hives and take from them a fragment of their carapace. When you can carry no more, return to me and I shall strengthen your resolve.The Hand of the Righteous^60^All^Silithus^Baristolth of the Shifting Sands^Baristolth of the Shifting Sands^^The Path of the Righteous^^Collect 200 Silithid Carapace Fragments and return to Baristolth.^Choose your deputies wisely, mortal. Each time you return with your task complete, a new deputy you will be allowed to choose. With that said, I require more of the carapace fragments. Waste no time!Anachronos^60^All^Silithus^Baristolth of the Shifting Sands^Anachronos^Anachronos^The Path of the Righteous^^Seek out Anachronos at the Caverns of Time in Tanaris.^It is time, <name>. I must apologize for keeping so much in secret. Enemies abound, even under our very noses. Please, read from this tome and learn. Take the knowledge I give to you and seek out our master.Dearest Natalia^60^All^Silithus^Commander Mar'alith^Commander Mar'alith^Dearest Natalia^^Glyph Chasing, Breaking the Code^Commander Mar'alith at Cenarion Hold in Silithus wants you to question the inhabitants of Bronzebeard's Encampment. You will find Bronzebeard's Encampment south of Cenarion Hold.^My dear Natalia has gone missing. Truth be told, she had been acting strangely for weeks leading up to her disappearance. I had caught her talking to herself when no one was around on more than one occasion. She was adamant that everything was ok and that she must be allowed to continue her research. She was last seen heading to Bronzebeard's camp to the south. My soldiers are spread too thin, <name>. I need you to go to Bronzebeard's camp and question those dwarves.Long Forgotten Memories^60^All^Silithus^Anachronos^Crystalline Tear^Anachronos^^^Locate the Crystalline Tear in Silithus and gaze into its depths.^In the southern desert of Silithus, near the sacred barrier, exists a single crystalline tear. This tear serves as a symbol of the great losses beset upon us during the War of the Shifting Sands. Locate this tear and gaze into its depths to gain enlightenment.Into The Maw of Madness^60^All^Silithus^Commander Mar'alith^Commander Mar'alith^Dearest Natalia^^^Commander Mar'alith at Cenarion Hold in Silithus wants you to find his beloved Natalia. The information that you gathered points to Hive'Regal in the south as being the area in which you may find Mistress Natalia Mar'alith.^I need you to venture into Hive'Regal and find what became of my dearest Natalia, <name>. This will be no easy task for you. Before you dive headlong into the maw of madness, make sure that you go back and speak with those dwarves. They might be able to give you some tips on dealing with the silithid that inhabit that hive. And <name>, if she truly is as mad as they say... do what you must. <Commander Mar'alith turns away from you.>Desert Recipe^57^All^Cooking^Calandrath^Sandy Cookbook^Desert Recipe^^^Look for information about cooking Sandworm Meat at the Twilight's Hammer camp west of Cenarion Hold.^Adapting to life in the desert has been difficult to say the least. Not only do I miss the birds and trees of Auberdine but our food selection is severely limited by this arid environment. I'm trying to learn about desert herbs, but there aren't many. I've seen Twilight's Hammer groups from the camp west of here hunt sandworms for food. Sandworm meat is so bitter though, I can't imagine how they make it palatable. Keep your eyes open if you go to their camp and let me know if you learn anything.Brann Bronzebeard's Lost Letter^60^All^Silithus^Brann Bronzebeard's Lost Letter^Rutgar Glyphshaper^^^^Take Brann Bronzebeard's Letter to Bronzebeard's Encampment in southern Silithus.^To Whom It May Concern: If you're reading this, I'm either dead or soon to be dead. It's hard to say. Most of the crew is dead anyhow. Found information about a Titan. Great battle between him and an Old God. Yes, a bona fide Old God. Found ancient tunnel leading to Ahn'Qiraj. Taking it. Take this letter to my old camp. Make sure my monkey is getting adequate food, water, and hugs. -Brann Bronzebeard, Explorer Extreme P.S. Watch out for crazy Old God worshipping night elf.Glyph Chasing^60^All^Silithus^Rutgar Glyphshaper^Rutgar Glyphshaper^^Dearest Natalia^Unraveling the Mystery^Rutgar Glyphshaper at Bronzebeard's Encampment in Silithus wants you to venture to Hive'Ashi, Hive'Zora, and Hive'Regal and recover Glyphed Rubbings from the Glyphed Crystals of each hive.^After our initial foray into the hives and Mistress Mar'alith's subsequent madness the three hives have been spewing out bugs! The increased activity might be tied into the glyphs covering those strange crystals. We must get a rubbing from crystals in all three hives. If we can get those rubbings, we might be able to make sense of this madness. Take this transcription set and hit those hives, <name>. Don't come back until you've gotten copies from each hive.Breaking the Code^60^All^Silithus^Frankal Stonebridge^Frankal Stonebridge^^Dearest Natalia^Unraveling the Mystery^Frankal Stonebridge at Bronzebeard's Encampment in Silithus wants you to recover a Hive'Zora Silithid Brain, Hive'Ashi Silithid Brain, and a Hive'Regal Silithid Brain. Return to Frankal when you have completed this task.^I think I can formulate an elixir that will allow us to more readily decipher the glyphs and language of the silithid and Qiraji! What do I need? Glad you asked! I need brains! More specifically, a brain from each silithid type that inhabit the hives. Bring me brains and Rutgar's work might not be for naught.Sharing the Knowledge^57^All^Cooking^Sandy Cookbook^Calandrath^Desert Recipe^^^Bring the Torn Recipe Page to Calandrath at the inn in Cenarion Hold.^While the recipe for cooking sandworm meat is legible, it contains references to herbs and spices you've never heard of. Calandrath might have enough knowledge of the plants that grow in the desert to make sense of it.Unraveling the Mystery^60^All^Silithus^Rutgar Glyphshaper^Geologist Larksbane^Unraveling the Mystery^Glyph Chasing, Breaking the Code^^Rutgar Glyphshaper at Bronzebeard's Encampment wants you to deliver the Glyphed Crystal Prism to Geologist Larksbane at the Cenarion Hold in Silithus.^We're on the verge of a breakthrough, <name>! The rubbings you recovered have allowed us to recreate the glyphs on this crystalline prism. They are apparently a means for the Qiraji and other unknown entities to communicate various messages to the silithid. Unfortunately, that is all we could get out of the glyphs. We need to find a way to unlock the messages hidden within the crystals. Take the glyphed crystal prism to Geologist Larksbane at Cenarion Hold. She might be able to help.The Calling^60^All^Silithus^Geologist Larksbane^Geologist Larksbane^Unraveling the Mystery^^Armaments of War, Armaments of War, Armaments of War, Armaments of War, Armaments of War, Armaments of War, Armaments of War, Armaments of War^Geologist Larksbane at Cenarion Hold in Silithus wants you to recover the Crystal Unlocking Mechanism from the Qiraji Emissary.^The glyphs illustrate an emissary of the Qiraji meeting with three silithid at the bones of a large dragon. Above the glyphs is what I can only assume to be a code of some sort. This code might very well be the key to summoning the emissary. I will create a copy of the glyph code that you must use in the sand at the Bones of Grakkarond. If I am right, the Overlords will come thinking that new data is ready for transmission. Strike them down and confront the emissary. He holds the key to the crystals...Kitchen Assistance^57^All^Cooking^Calandrath^Calandrath^Desert Recipe^^^Calandrath at Cenarion Hold needs a batch of 10 Smoked Desert Dumplings.^That recipe sure will come in handy. I'd better get to work so I can have some smoked desert dumplings ready for today. I could use a hand in making some, I'll make it worth your while.Secret Communication^60^All^Silithus^Bor Wildmane^Bor Wildmane^^^Encrypted Twilight Texts^Bring 10 Encrypted Twilight Texts to Bor Wildmane in Cenarion Hold.^Some of the Twilight's Hammer cultists carry around little papers with gibberish written on them. I want you to bring me a stack of them, <class>. I can't figure out what the gibberish means, but that's not the point! These papers are how their different groups communicate secretly. The more texts we take out of circulation, the less they can communicate!Twilight Geolords^60^All^Silithus^Huum Wildmane^Huum Wildmane^Twilight Geolords^^^Kill 10 Twilight Geolords, then return to Huum Wildmane in Cenarion Hold.^The Twilight's Hammer, an insane cult bent on destruction, set up camps in Silithus and perform rituals day and night. We do not yet know their plans, but we do think they are somehow linked to the pulsing red crystals spread across the desert. Although their mystery may one day be solved, we must first deal with their immediate threat. Go to their camps to the west and seek out Twilight geolords. They are the heads of these serpents; that is where we must strike!Vyral the Vile^60^All^Silithus^Huum Wildmane^Huum Wildmane^Twilight Geolords^^^Bring Vyral's Signet Ring to Huum Wildmane in Cenarion Hold.^We have discovered another base of operations for the Twilight's Hammer. It is called Twilight's Run; it is a cave tucked in the northeast corner of Silithus. The local leader of the cult, Vyral the Vile, haunts that cave - it is he who you must next defeat. When you have done this, bring me his signet ring. Fortune to you, <name>. The horrors of Twilight's Run are formidable indeed.True Believers^59^All^Silithus^Hermit Ortell^Hermit Ortell^^The Twilight Lexicon^Still Believing^Hermit Ortell wants you to bring him 10 Encrypted Twilight Texts^Now that I have the Twilight Lexicon in my possession, there is a small favor I'd like to ask of you. My former organization has a secret encoded bulletin they circulate on a monthly basis. If they make any progress searching for me or if they call off the search, word will be published on the True Believer. Although this information is obviously valuable to me, the publication contains other useful information that I can share. Bring me any encoded texts you find on Twilight's Hammer members.Reclaiming Sunstrider Isle^1^Blood Elf^Eversong Woods^Magistrix Erona^Magistrix Erona^^^Unfortunate Measures, Mage Training, Warlock Training, Priest Training, Rogue Training, Hunter Training, Paladin Training^Kill 8 Mana Wyrms; they are located close to the Burning Crystals that are adjacent to the tower and gazebo.^The sooner you begin your education, <name>, the better for us all. There is little room for error, so listen closely. The Burning Crystals - the green floating objects to the west of the Sunspire here - have long been used to power the isle's experimentations. The mana wyrms were their guardians, but the Scourge invasion of Quel'Thalas has driven them errant from our lack of magical control over them. There is little choice but to thin their numbers for reclamation. Do this, then return to me.Unfortunate Measures^3^Blood Elf^Eversong Woods^Magistrix Erona^Magistrix Erona^Unfortunate Measures^Reclaiming Sunstrider Isle^^Collect 8 Lynx Collars from slain Springpaw Lynxes and Springpaw Cubs. Return to Magistrix Erona on Sunstrider Isle when you are done.^Your effort has made something clear that, honestly, I wish were not true. The unchecked power of the Burning Crystals has maligned a much larger swath of the isle's natural balance than I thought. We must now take on more unfortunate measures to reclaim control. The nearby lynxes have succumbed to the influence of the crystals, and they must be put down. Bring their collars, <name>, as I may yet be able to fashion a magical restraint to turn some back from being uncontrolled.Report to Lanthan Perilon^3^Blood Elf^Eversong Woods^Magistrix Erona^Lanthan Perilon^Unfortunate Measures^^^Speak with Lanthan Perilon on Sunstrider Isle; he is standing close to the path running west away from the Sunspire.^You are to report to my assistant, Lanthan Perilon. He will instruct you on what needs to be done next. While we here at the Sunspire will continue to rein in the Burning Crystals, you will be focused on a more pressing matter concerning Falthrien Academy. Lanthan will explain fully when you speak to him. Simply walk west of here along the path, and you should see him standing close by. Good luck, <name> - your continued successes shall be rewarded.Mage Training^1^Blood Elf^Mage^Magistrix Erona^Julia Sunstriker^^Reclaiming Sunstrider Isle^Well Watcher Solanian^Speak with Julia Sunstriker - the Mage class trainer - inside the Sunspire on Sunstrider Isle.^As you advance within your class, you will want to take advantage of the training that your class trainer can provide you. For young mages here on Sunstrider Isle, your trainer is Julia Sunstriker. Speak with Julia and see what training she has available for you. The things she will teach do have a cost, so bring some coin with you. Julia - as with all the trainers on Sunstrider Isle - is inside the Sunspire on the lower level.Solanian's Belongings^4^Blood Elf^Eversong Woods^Well Watcher Solanian^Well Watcher Solanian^^^^Collect Well Watcher Solanian's Scrying Orb, his Scroll of Scourge Magic, and his Journal. They are found on Sunstrider Isle by the pond, the fountain, and one of the Burning Crystals. Return them to the Well Watcher at the Sunspire on Sunstrider Isle when you've collected them all.^With all the chaos happening here at the Sunspire, I haven't had a chance to collect my belongings I've left outside at various places on the isle. I must maintain my vigil over the Sunwell here, so I'll ask you to collect them in my stead. I need my scrying orb, my scroll of Scourge magic, and my journal. Use this satchel for some extra space, as my things are rather bulky. Return them to me and I'll give you a little something - you know, for the effort; you can keep the satchel as well!Aurel Goldleaf^60^All^Silithus^Huum Wildmane^Aurel Goldleaf^Aurel Goldleaf^^^Speak with Aurel Goldleaf in Cenarion Hold.^<name>, although we had hoped the Twilight's Hammer's operations in Silithus were slowing... we were, regrettably, mistaken. Through continued forays against the cult, we have learned that an even darker power, the Abyssal Council, controls the Hammer through the arcane wind stones dotted amongst the cult's camps.
