column1: The Perfect Poison^60^All^Silithus^Dirk Thunderwood^Dirk Thunderwood^^^^Dirk Thunderwood at Cenarion Hold wants you to bring him Venoxis's Venom Sac and Kurinnaxx's Venom Sac.^My brother and I run the poison operations out of the manor Ravenholdt. Lord Ravenholdt tasked me to track down a new and extremely effective poison compound that can be crafted from the venom sacs of the inhabitants of Zul'Gurub and the Ruins of Ahn'Qiraj. There are two particularly venomous beasts residing in those blasted ruins that possess what it is that we might be looking for
column2: <class>. Bring me a venom sac from the beasts Kurinnaxx and Venoxis and we would be eternally grateful.

column1: Bodley's Unfortunate Fate^60^Horde^Blackrock Mountain^Mokvar^Bodley^Anthion's Parting Words^^Three Kings of Flame^Travel to Blackrock Mountain and use the Extra-Dimensional Ghost Revealer to find Bodley near Blackrock Spire.^The medallion contained Valthalak's soul? It's no surprise it was guarded by such a powerful curse. Locating Bodley presents a bit of a problem. Last time I heard of him
column2: he was preparing to venture back into Blackrock Spire. He was never heard of again. Seek him out in Blackrock Mountain
column3: though I'm afraid to say he's probably dead by now. I suggest taking the goblin's device with you
column4: friend.

column66: 2Bindings of Faith^Commander Eligor Dawnbringer at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands wants you to slay 5 Living Monstrosities
column68: 8 Deathknight Captains and 3 Venom Stalkers.^Five years since the last war... Tens of thousands of lives were lost and for what? The threat was never fully extinguished. And so the Lich King stirs once more... His yes-man
column70: amassing for another attack upon our lands. We will not allow it! Prove your dedication. Prove that you are willing to risk life and limb to stop this madness and the combined might of the Dawn and the Crusade will be at your beck and call. Enter Naxxramas and destroy the Scourge within...

column1: Roadside Ambush^6^Horde^Eversong Woods^Apprentice Ralen^Apprentice Meledor^Roadside Ambush^^^Speak to Apprentice Meledor in Eversong Woods along the road heading south from Silvermoon City.^You
column2: there! You must help me
column3: please! A fellow apprentice and I were attacked by the Wretched! In their mad hunger for magic
column4: they took everything they could get their hands on: mana crystals
column5: wands
column6: spellbooks... everything! Meledor gave chase after them; I had to stay behind and look after what they didn't take. Continue down the road and see if you can lend him a hand.

column1: Redemption Headpiece^60^All^Paladin^Commander Eligor Dawnbringer^Commander Eligor Dawnbringer^^Echoes of War^^Commander Eligor Dawnbringer at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands will make a Redemption Headpiece if you bring him the following: 1 Desecrated Headpiece
column2: 15 Wartorn Plate Scraps
column3: 5 Arcanite Bars and 2 Cured Rugged Hides.^You will find the remnants of our fallen heroes on the corpses of the Lords of Naxxramas. Bring those desecrated keepsakes to me along with wartorn plate scraps and crafting materials capable of revitalizing the cursed armor and I shall craft a fine piece of armor for you.

column1: Toxic Test^52^All^Druid^Torwa Pathfinder^Torwa Pathfinder^Torwa Pathfinder^^^Stab a Devilsaur with the Devilsaur Barb. Return to Torwa Pathfinder in Un'Goro Crater when you have completed this task.^The toxin you helped me create is for a special purpose. The great devilsaurs of the crater make it dangerous to hunt and difficult for me to survive. Even if I possessed the necessary strength
column2: killing a devilsaur simply allows another to move into its territory. Take this poisoned barb and stab it deep into a living devilsaur. The toxin should pacify the creature
column3: though I do not know how quickly...

column1: Bloodpetal Poison^52^All^Druid^Torwa Pathfinder^Torwa Pathfinder^Torwa Pathfinder^^^Collect 8 Bloodcap and 8 Gorishi Stings
column2: and return to Torwa Pathfinder in Un'Goro Crater.^I would ask you to help me create a toxin of sorts
column3: to pacify a great creature living here in the crater. It is not deadly
column4: and only the keen eyes of a <class> can hope to collect the ingredients. You can find the bloodcap mushrooms growing within the bloodpetal sprouts all across the crater. Gorishi stings are from the insects inside and around the Slithering Scar
column5: located in the southern part of the crater.

column1: A Better Ingredient^52^All^Druid^Torwa Pathfinder^Torwa Pathfinder^Torwa Pathfinder^^^Retrieve a Putrid Vine from the guardian at the bottom of the Sunken Temple and return to Torwa Pathfinder.^It is as I feared -- the toxin is simply too weak for such a powerful creature. If we are to create a toxin of high enough potency
column2: you must venture to the bottom of the Temple of Atal'Hakkar
column3: unlock the secrets of the altar and recover a putrid vine from the guardian there. The temple is dangerous
column4: and it would behoove you to bring friends. Return to me when this is done.

column1: Soaked Pages^6^Horde^Eversong Woods^Apprentice Meledor^Apprentice Meledor^Roadside Ambush^^^Apprentice Meledor in Eversong Woods wants you to search the water beneath the bridge nearby and bring him Antheol's Elemental Grimoire.^Those blasted Wretched sure can run fast at the sight of someone who'll stand up to them. But let's not worry about that now. I need to find my instructor's elemental grimoire. I'm certain I saw one of those cowards throw it into the river but I cannot seem to be able to locate it. I could use another set of eyes. I'll throw in a bit of coin if you spot it.

Torwa Pathfinder^52^All^Druid^Turak Runetotem^Torwa Pathfinder^Torwa Pathfinder^^^Speak with Torwa Pathfinder in Un'Goro Crater.^A hunter by the name of Torwa Pathfinder has requested the help of a druid. He said only we would possess the necessary skills and respect for nature to help him. There is a road that connects the Un'Goro Crater and the desert of Tanaris. As that road enters the crater
column2: you will find Torwa close by.

column1: Taking the Fall^6^Horde^Eversong Woods^Apprentice Meledor^Instructor Antheol^Roadside Ambush^^^Bring Antheol's Elemental Grimoire to Instructor Antheol at Stillwhisper Pond in Eversong Woods.^Antheol is going to fly off his rocker when he finds out his book is ruined. I've got a little proposal for you; don't worry
column2: I'll make it worth your while. Take this book to him and tell him nothing of this incident. If he asks
column3: just tell him you dropped the book into a puddle. He has no direct authority over you
column4: so there's not much he can do. Antheol delivers his lectures at Stillwhisper Pond
column5: southeast of Silvermoon. You'll do this for us
column6: right? I'll reward you handsomely for this favor!

column1: Swift Discipline^6^Horde^Eversong Woods^Instructor Antheol^Instructor Antheol^Roadside Ambush^^^Use Antheol's Disciplinary Rod on his two students: Apprentice Ralen and Apprentice Meledor. Return to Antheol at Stillwhisper Pond in Eversong Woods with the rod after this.^I hope you learn a valuable lesson today
column2: <name>. Never trust someone else to lie for you. Now I want you to go back to my two dimwitted students and discipline them using this wand. My magic tells me that you'll find them along the road to the west on the other side of the Dead Scar. Come back to me after you've done this. I'll give you a small reward for your troubles.

column1: The Party Never Ends^9^Horde^Eversong Woods^Lord Saltheril^Lord Saltheril^Saltheril's Haven^^^Acquire a bottle of Suntouched Special Reserve
column2: Springpaw Appetizers and a Bundle of Fireworks
column3: and return them to Lord Saltheril at Saltheril's Haven in Eversong Woods.^I like to throw parties... just a little something to celebrate the magnificence that is Quel'Thalas! But
column4: I'm in a bit of a bind. I need you to gather up more party supplies. From Vinemaster Suntouched at the Silvermoon City inn
column5: bring me a bottle of Suntouched Special Reserve. From Zalene Firstlight at Farstrider Retreat acquire more of those delicious Springpaw Appetizers. And you can pick up my delivery of fireworks from Halis Dawnstrider at Fairbreeze Village. Be quick about it!

column1: Wretched Ringleader^8^Horde^Eversong Woods^Velendris Whitemorn^Velendris Whitemorn^Lost Armaments^^^Bring Aldaron's Head to Velendris Whitemorn near Sunsail Anchorage in Eversong Woods.^The Wretched are so oblivious
column2: gorging on foul magic
column3: that they haven't realized we've recovered most of our weapons. We can't expect them to remain in their stupor
column4: though. Now is the time for a decisive attack. Let us make an example of their leader
column5: Aldaron. He was spotted on the top floor of the building by the anchorage. Bring me his head; I'll reward you suitably.

column1: Shadows of Doom^50^All^Scourge Invasion^Commander Thomas Helleran^Commander Thomas Helleran^^^^Go to a summoning circle and kill a Shadow of Doom
column2: then return to Commander Thomas Helleran at Light's Hope Chapel in Eastern Plaguelands.^After you bring down the defenses of the Scourge summoning circles
column3: you must confront the acolytes who protect them. In truth
column4: these are not men. They are shadows
column5: some of the Lich King's most frightening creatures. They can be revealed using the necrotic runes they carry
column6: and then destroyed with magic or strength of arms.

column1: Malfunction at the West Sanctum^5^Horde^Eversong Woods^Ley-Keeper Caidanis^Ley-Keeper Velania^Major Malfunction^^^Speak to Ley-Keeper Velania at the West Sanctum in Eversong Woods.^Since you're here
column2: <name>
column3: I've a favor to ask you. Ley-Keeper Velania's apprentice dropped by earlier to ask for assistance. Apparently there's some malfunction happening at the West Sanctum. I've been a bit busy entertaining our... most pleasant... dwarven guest. See if you can give her a hand. You'll find the West Sanctum southwest of here.

column1: The Fall of Kel'Thuzad^60^All^Naxxramas^The Phylactery of Kel'Thuzad^ ^^^^Take the Phylactery of Kel'Thuzad to Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands.^The phylactery is all that remains of the master of Naxxramas. Your better judgment dictates that you destroy the phylactery
column2: preventing the lich from ever reforming. Thankfully
column3: you seldom listen to that internal voice of reason. Someone at Light's Hope will pay you hugely for this artifact. Who cares if Kel'Thuzad regenerates to full power?

column1: The Dread Citadel - Naxxramas^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Archmage Angela Dosantos^Archmage Angela Dosantos^^^Echoes of War^Archmage Angela Dosantos at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands wants 5 Arcane Crystals
column2: 2 Nexus Crystals
column3: 1 Righteous Orb and 60 gold pieces. You must also be Honored with the Argent Dawn.^In the thick of Plaguewood lies the entrance to the dread citadel of Naxxramas. Previously
column4: all attempts to enter had been stymied by the magical wards placed upon the rune portal. That is
column5: until now. We have devised a way to gain entry via arcane cloaking - an old cantrip of the Kirin Tor with a few modifications of my own. Since your dedication to the cause of the Dawn is somewhat lacking
column6: <name>
column7: the price will be high. You may decline and choose to return when you are revered or exalted for a discount.

column1: The Dread Citadel - Naxxramas^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Archmage Angela Dosantos^Archmage Angela Dosantos^^^Echoes of War^Archmage Angela Dosantos at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands wants 2 Arcane Crystals
column2: 1 Nexus Crystal and 30 gold pieces. You must also be Revered with the Argent Dawn.^In the thick of Plaguewood lies the entrance to the dread citadel of Naxxramas. Previously
column3: all attempts to enter had been stymied by the magical wards placed upon the rune portal. That is
column4: until now. We have devised a way to gain entry via a permanent arcane cloaking of sorts - an old cantrip of the Kirin Tor with a few modifications of my own. With that said
column5: the cloaking is costly. Since your dedication to the cause of the Dawn is admirable
column6: we are willing to incur some of those costs.

column1: The Dread Citadel - Naxxramas^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Archmage Angela Dosantos^Archmage Angela Dosantos^^^Echoes of War^Archmage Angela Dosantos at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands will grant you Arcane Cloaking at no cost. You must be Exalted with the Argent Dawn.^In the thick of Plaguewood lies the entrance to the dread citadel of Naxxramas. Previously
column2: all attempts to enter had been stymied by the magical wards placed upon the rune portal. That is
column3: until now. We have devised a way to gain entry via a permanent arcane cloaking of sorts - an old cantrip of the Kirin Tor with a few modifications of my own. With that said
column4: the cloaking is costly; however
column5: your dedication to the cause of the Dawn is unwavering! We will waive all cost associations.

column1: Cryptstalker Armor Doesn't Make Itself...^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Huntsman Leopold^Huntsman Leopold^^^Crypt Fiend Parts^Huntsman Leopold at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands wants 30 Crypt Fiend Parts.^How would you like to earn yourself one of these shiny coins? <Leopold holds up an insignia of the Crusade.> I've got a little problem that you might be able to help me with
column2: <name>. You see
column3: I make Cryptstalker armor for those daft enough to venture into Naxxramas. While they supply me with the core material requirements for the armor
column4: I always run out of the crypt fiend parts. Bring me back a bundle of parts and I'll pay you with an insignia - usable at the quartermaster.

column1: Bonescythe Digs^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Rohan the Assassin^Rohan the Assassin^^^Bone Fragments^Rohan the Assassin at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands wants 30 Bone Fragments.^Don Julio's Bonescythe armor pattern requires bone fragments - a lot of bone fragments. While those crazy enough to venture into Naxxramas provide me with enough of the core materials to make the armor
column2: I'm always looking for more Scourge bone fragments. So what do you think? Interested in getting your hands dirty and destroying some Scourge at the same time? It's a win-win situation.

column1: The Elemental Equation^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Archmage Angela Dosantos^Archmage Angela Dosantos^^^Core of Elements^Archmage Angela Dosantos at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands wants 30 Core of Elements.^Greetings
column2: adventurer! Are you interested in some work? I pay those under my employ with insignias. These insignias can be used at the Quartermaster to purchase items of power. All I need you to do is bring me as many core of elements as you can carry. The more the better! You'll find them on elementals of varying shapes and sizes that exist across our world.

column1: Goods from Silvermoon City^10^Blood Elf^Ghostlands^Quartermaster Lymel^Skymaster Sunwing^Goods from Silvermoon City^The Forsaken^^Deliver Quartermaster Lymel's Bill of Lading to Skymaster Sunwing in Tranquillien.^Welcome volunteer! We're running low on supplies here
column2: but the blood elves have promised us materiel assistance. That's where you come in. Take this bill of lading over to Skymaster Sunwing. He'll have further instructions for you on how best to get up to Silvermoon City.

column1: Binding the Dreadnaught^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Korfax
column2: Champion of the Light^Korfax
column3: Champion of the Light^^^Dark Iron Scraps^Korfax at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands wants 30 Dark Iron Scraps.^Have you ever seen Dreadnaught armor
column4: <class>? No
column5: of course you haven't. You're still a <boy/girl> - a tyke. Let me tell you
column6: it is glorious. You're probably asking yourself what any of this has to do with you
column7: right? I'll tell you what
column8: scrub; I need Dark Iron scraps and I'm willing to pay to get my hands on as many as possible. I need the scraps to put together sets of Dreadnaught for our champions. Bring me scraps and get paid.

column1: Fly to Silvermoon City^10^Blood Elf^Ghostlands^Skymaster Sunwing^Sathren Azuredawn^Goods from Silvermoon City^^^Purchase a flight to Silvermoon City and deliver Quartermaster Lymel's Bill of Lading to Sathren Azuredawn in Silvermoon City.^<class>
column2: for a very modest amount of coin
column3: I can send you swiftly flying through the air on one of these magnificent beasts. And
column4: it's safer than walking there
column5: I can assure you! When you arrive in Silvermoon City
column6: seek out Sathren Azuredawn in the Bazaar. Speak with me once more when you've decided you're ready to brave the skies.

column1: Skymistress Gloaming^10^Blood Elf^Ghostlands^Sathren Azuredawn^Skymistress Gloaming^Goods from Silvermoon City^^^Bring Quartermaster Lymel's Goods to Skymistress Gloaming just outside Silvermoon City's Shepherd's Gate.^It doesn't look as if you have a cart or a beast of burden with you
column2: so I'd better send you back only with what you can carry. If you've spoken with Skymaster Sunwing at Tranquillien
column3: then you should get this to Quartermaster Lymel as soon as possible by flying back. Take these goods for final inspection to Skymistress Gloaming just outside Silvermoon City's Shepherd's Gate.

column1: Return to Quartermaster Lymel^10^Blood Elf^Ghostlands^Skymistress Gloaming^Quartermaster Lymel^Goods from Silvermoon City^^^Purchase a flight back to Tranquillien in the Ghostlands and deliver Quartermaster Lymel's Goods to Quartermaster Lymel at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^It all checks out as far as I can tell. Seems to me that the Forsaken have put their backs to the wall for us and we owe them
column2: even if they are all ugly and rotting. So
column3: the question is
column4: have you already spoken to Skymaster Sunwing in Tranquillien? If so
column5: then this can be as simple as you paying the small fare and quickly flying back. Let me know when you're ready.

column1: Savage Flora^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Rayne^Rayne^^^Savage Fronds^Rayne at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands wants 30 Savage Fronds.^I make a special type of armor for the brave heroes that enter Naxxramas known as Dreamwalker. They are able to provide me with most of the materials I require but I am always looking for those able to retrieve savage fronds from the flora of our world. You may think of this job as beneath you
column2: but without the fronds
column3: the armor could not be made. I am also in a unique position to pay you with an insignia of your choice as both the Dawn and the Crusade supply me with funds.

column1: Suncrown Village^10^Horde^Ghostlands^Arcanist Vandril^Arcanist Vandril^The Forsaken^^^Slay 10 Nerubis Guards and then return to Arcanist Vandril at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^We're surrounded here
column2: <class>. The outlying villages have all been overrun by the Scourge! You must head northeast to Suncrown Village immediately and deal with the Nerubian Scourge menace. You can't miss them - they're spider-like creatures. There's no time to waste.... Quel'Thalas must be reclaimed!

column1: Goldenmist Village^11^Horde^Ghostlands^Arcanist Vandril^Arcanist Vandril^The Forsaken^^^Defeat 6 Quel'dorei Ghosts and 4 Quel'dorei Wraiths at Goldenmist Village
column2: and then return to Arcanist Vandril at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^We've had one success
column3: but there are two more villages that must be reclaimed! Goldenmist Village is our next target. It lies to the northwest
column4: and has been taken by the ghosts of the high elves that used to live there. Gruesome
column5: I know
column6: but these are apparently the sorts of tactics that the Scourge like to employ. Go and defeat these ghosts and wraiths
column7: <class>. Take the west road out of Tranquillien to get there.

column1: Windrunner Village^14^Horde^Ghostlands^Arcanist Vandril^Arcanist Vandril^The Forsaken^^^Gather 6 Phantasmal Substance and 4 Gargoyle Fragments. Return them to Arcanist Vandril at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^<name>
column2: the final battle against the Ghostlands villages is upon you. Windrunner Village to the southwest has been overrun by a large force of the more powerful Scourge shocktroopers; shades and gargoyles. You will be the spearpoint of our offensive by thinning out their numbers. The magisters at the nearby Sanctum of the Sun have made a special request this time; they want the remains from these Scourge to study in hopes of finding creative ways of fighting them. Good hunting!

column1: They Call Me "The Rooster"^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Dispatch Commander Metz^Dispatch Commander Metz^^^Craftsman's Writ^Dispatch Commander Metz at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands wants an Argent Dawn Valor Token.^You want a writ? What? Do you expect me to hand you a highly sought after work order just for showing up? I think not
column2: scrub. Crafters from around the world bid for jobs here at the front lines. If you want a work order
column3: you'll have to show me that you're willing to bleed for the cause. Bring me a valor token and we'll talk. And there's only one way to get your grubby little scrub mitts on those - get to killin'.

column1: Dealing with Zeb'Sora^12^Horde^Ghostlands^Ranger Valanna^Ranger Valanna^Help Ranger Valanna!^^^Collect 6 Zeb'Sora Troll Ears and return them to Ranger Valanna in the Ghostlands.^The lieutenant here rushed us into battle with the trolls across the lake instead of scouting the situation first. We were decimated by his stupidity! You hear me Tomathren? You're an idiot! Will you help us
column2: <class>? Those trolls still need to be dealt with. I need to stay here and nursemaid him -- I think he's lost his mind. Just head east to the other side of the lake into Zeb'Sora. I want revenge... bring me their ears so that I can fashion a nice necklace!

column1: Missing in the Ghostlands^10^Horde^Ghostlands^Magistrix Landra Dawnstrider^Courier Dawnstrider^^^The Fallen Courier^Follow the road out of Fairbreeze Village towards the south and look for Courier Dawnstrider as you approach the Ghostlands.^My nephew was sent into the Ghostlands a few days ago. He never mentioned anything about his task
column2: except that it was of an extremely secret nature. He never returned and I fear for the worst
column3: <class>. A missing messenger might not mean much to the callous magisters of Silvermoon
column4: but he's like a son to me. Please
column5: <name>
column6: will you look for him?

column1: Help Ranger Valanna!^12^Horde^Ghostlands^Ranger Lethvalin^Ranger Valanna^Help Ranger Valanna!^^^Find Ranger Valanna and Lieutenant Tomathren on the shore of Lake Elrendar in the Ghostlands near Suncrown Village.^<class>
column2: I can't just sit here waiting for an audience with the high executor or Dame Auriferous! This cannot wait! We were dealing with the Shadowpine trolls of Zeb'Sora to the northeast across Lake Elrendar. But the lieutenant mishandled the attack and we lost a lot of Farstriders. Then he just fell to pieces afterward. Ranger Valanna sent me here
column3: and Ranger Salissa to the Farstrider Enclave for help. Please find them
column4: <class>. Valanna was badly injured and the lieutenant's useless.

column1: Report to Captain Helios^12^Horde^Ghostlands^Ranger Valanna^Captain Helios^Help Ranger Valanna!^^^Speak with Captain Helios at the Farstrider Enclave on the southern shore of Lake Elrendar in the Ghostlands.^I need one last favor of you
column2: <class>. Just in case Ranger Salissa didn't make it back to Farstrider Enclave on the south edge of the lake
column3: I need you to go there and get help. Just check in with Captain Helios and let him know what's happened here. I'm sure he'll send help back as soon as he can.

column1: The Fallen Courier^10^Horde^Ghostlands^Apothecary Thedra^Apothecary Thedra^^Missing in the Ghostlands^Delivery to Tranquillien^Apothecary Thedra in Eversong Woods wants you to bring her 4 Plagued Blood Samples from beasts in the Ghostlands.^What are you standing around for? Can't you see this boy needs immediate attention? By the looks of it
column2: the plague is beginning to take over his body. Within minutes not even a master apothecary like me will be able to save him. The animals south of the river all carry the plague in their blood. Go across the bridge and hunt the plagued beasts there. Bring me enough plagued blood samples and I'll distill a serum capable of saving this blood elf. Hurry!

column1: Delivery to Tranquillien^10^Horde^Ghostlands^Courier Dawnstrider^Arcanist Vandril^^The Fallen Courier^^Bring the Letter from Silvermoon to Arcanist Vandril at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^I... I'm too weak to continue. I carry a dire warning from Regent Lord Theron
column2: in the form of a letter. You'll have to deliver it for me. Take it to Arcanist Vandril in Tranquillien. You'll find the town further to the south along this road. Go there and... find Vandril...

column1: The Plagued Coast^13^Horde^Ghostlands^Apothecary Renzithen^Apothecary Renzithen^^^^Bring 6 Plagued Murloc Spines to Apothecary Renzithen in Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^To find a cure for the plague we need to understand how it affects different creatures
column2: from the most complex life forms to the lowliest subspecies. I've come here to study the murlocs since
column3: like us
column4: they've retained free will in undeath. What makes these lowly mongrels so special? I need to find out
column5: <name>! Travel northwest and bring me their spines so that I may study the accumulation of plague in their marrow. Who knows what secrets their little bones hold?

column1: Salvaging the Past^12^Horde^Ghostlands^Magister Darenis^Magister Darenis^^^^Magister Darenis wants you to travel to the Sanctum of the Moon to the west of Tranquillien and recover 8 Crystallized Mana Essences from the Arcane Devourers and Mana Shifters that inhabit the structure.^Can you believe it? We have an actual functioning arcane sanctum up and running southeast of here: the Sanctum of the Sun. All manner of important magisters have come to take part in running it. Of course they've all forgotten about the Sanctum of the Moon. Not much remains of it and its energies have given rise to bizarre creatures. I'm not one to let good resources go to waste
column2: however. Go to the Sanctum of the Moon and see if you can recover the crystallized essences from the creatures there.

column1: The Sanctum of the Sun^20^Horde^Ghostlands^Magister Darenis^Magister Idonis^The Sanctum of the Sun^^^Speak to Magister Idonis in the Sanctum of the Sun in the Ghostlands.^You've proven your loyalty to Tranquillien and have helped us defend it against the threat of the Scourge. Some of our most powerful magisters have come from Silvermoon to help us take the fight to the enemy's doorstep. They've rebuilt the arcane sanctum to the south and have driven the Scourge away from the surrounding area. They plan to launch an offensive into Deatholme
column2: Dar'Khan's stronghold. You would do well to join them
column3: <name>. I'm sure they can make use of a seasoned <class> like yourself.

column1: Tomber's Supplies^11^Horde^Ghostlands^Rathis Tomber^Rathis Tomber^^^^Retrieve Rathis Tomber's Supplies and return it to him at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^How am I supposed to supply the war effort when I cannot even safely get my supplies here? I was promised an escort that never came. And then
column2: I had to leave one of my carts behind to the west when I was attacked by a band of ghouls! Want to help out
column3: and get me open for business in the process? Go down the western road out of town and past the graveyard. On the other side of the Dead Scar is a fork in the road. The hill that my cart had to be left on lies just beyond.

column1: Under the Shadow^50^All^Scourge Invasion^Commander Thomas Helleran^Commander Thomas Helleran^^^^Check your map to find an area under Scourge attack. Go there and damage a necropolis by defeating the Scourge around them. Return 10 of their Necrotic Runes to Commander Thomas Helleran at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands.^The floating necropolises of the Scourge plague the lands of Horde and Alliance alike. Tanaris
column2: the Blasted Lands
column3: Winterspring and the Burning Steppes are blanketed in the shadows of the flying fortresses. Only through our combined efforts will they be repelled. Each necropolis is supported by nearby magical circles
column4: and among each circle swarms a host of undead creartures. We have determined that destroying these mindless hordes will destroy the circle's defenses.

column1: Down the Dead Scar^14^Horde^Ghostlands^Deathstalker Rathiel^Deathstalker Rathiel^^^^Slay 10 Risen Hungerers and 10 Gangled Cannibals on the Dead Scar. Return to Deathstalker Rathiel in Tranquillien for a reward.^If you've made it this far then you probably know about the Dead Scar and how to this day mindless Scourge follow the path of destruction that Arthas created on his way to Silvermoon City. Make yourself useful and thin down the Scourge's numbers in the Scar. If you prove to be worth your salt I'll put in a good word for you.

Wanted: Knucklerot and Luzran^21^Horde^Ghostlands^Wanted Poster^Deathstalker Rathiel^^^^Search the Ghostlands for Knucklerot and Luzran. Bring their heads to Deathstalker Rathiel in Tranquillien for a reward.^A bounty is hereby declared for the abominations known as Knucklerot and Luzran. These dreadful creations of Dar'Khan are extremely dangerous and have been sighted patrolling near the Howling and Bleeding Ziggurats. Individuals seeking to claim the reward must present the abominations' heads to Deathstalker Rathiel as proof of the deed.
Forgotten Rituals^12^Horde^Ghostlands^Geranis Whitemorn^Geranis Whitemorn^Forgotten Rituals^^^Bring 8 Wavefront Medallions to Geranis Whitemorn in the Ghostlands.^Every year we
column2: the denizens of Suncrown Village
column3: would take part in a ritual to keep the different aspects of nature under our control. Dominion over the element of water was symbolized by the summoning and enslavement of an elemental named Aquantion. Through a wicked perversion of our magic
column4: the scoundrel broke his bonds and enslaved us instead! We wore medallions shaped like waves during the ritual. Seek them at the bottom of the lake; we'll need them to free my compatriots' spirits!

column1: Bearers of the Plague^14^Horde^Ghostlands^Farstrider Sedina^Farstrider Sedina^^^Curbing the Plague^Farstrider Sedina at the Farstrider Enclave in the Ghostlands wants you to slay 10 Ghostclaw Lynxes.^You show courage coming to the Ghostlands
column2: <name>. There is much work to be done here and not enough brave souls to do it. I've a thankless task to offer you
column3: should you have the inclination to aid our cause. The very wildlife in this land has been tainted by the plague and we must stop it from spreading. Hunt the ghostclaw lynxes to the east and south of here and return when you've slain enough of them.

column1: Curbing the Plague^15^Horde^Ghostlands^Farstrider Sedina^Farstrider Sedina^^Bearers of the Plague^^Farstrider Sedina at the Farstrider Enclave in the Ghostlands wants you to slay 8 Spindleweb Lurkers and 10 Vampiric Mistbats.^You've proven your worth as an ally
column2: <name>. I need you to continue your task and track down more plagued wildlife. This time seek out some of the more dangerous beasts. Hunt the spindleweb lurkers west of the Dead Scar and the vampiric mistbats just south of here. Return to me when you're done.

column1: Investigate An'daroth^11^Horde^Ghostlands^Dame Auriferous^Dame Auriferous^Investigate An'daroth^^^Investigate the area at An'daroth
column2: kill 12 Sentinel Spies and then return to Dame Auriferous at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^<class>
column3: we are having difficulty with a group of night elves that have recently taken over a nearby island. They've set up a small camp at the old high elf ley-line nexus
column4: An'daroth
column5: to the northwest. There is a dirt path that leads up to it just past the Dead Scar. I suggest that you lend us your aid by going there
column6: investigating what they are up to
column7: and slaying as many of the conceited night elves as you can.

column1: The Traitor's Shadow^16^Horde^Ghostlands^Ranger Vynna^Dusty Journal^The Farstrider Enclave^^^Travel to Dawnstar Spire in the Ghostlands and search for any clues involving Dar'Khan's past.^Dar'Khan Drathir is believed to have returned from the dead to rule over the armies of the Scourge in the Ghostlands. Dar'Khan aligned himself with the Scourge long ago... yet he was once a living
column2: breathing elf. Much of his time was spent inside Dawnstar Spire
column3: northeast of here. He hid there for many nights
column4: scheming against his own. Search the tower for more information
column5: <name>. Perhaps he had a journal or kept notes. One never knows where useful information might present itself.

column1: Hints of the Past^16^Horde^Ghostlands^Dusty Journal^Ranger Vynna^The Farstrider Enclave^^^Return to Ranger Vynna at the Farstrider Enclave with Dar'Khan's Journal.^As you skim through the pages in the journal you're overcome by an unnerving sense of being watched. The contents are unsettling. Dar'Khan's soul was one filled with hatred and contempt for his own people. The extent of his machinations and plots are all documented in great detail. Perhaps there is something here that Vynna will find useful.
Into Occupied Territory^14^Horde^Ghostlands^Dame Auriferous^Dame Auriferous^Investigate An'daroth^^^Steal the Night Elf Plans: An'daroth
column2: Night Elf Plans: An'owyn and Night Elf Plans: Scrying on the Sin'dorei
column3: and return them to Dame Auriferous at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^Now
column4: the more direct course of action that we are going to take
column5: to figure out what these night elves are really up to
column6: is to have you go to their island and steal any information that you can come by. I want you to head west down the road out of town to Shalandis Isle
column7: just off the coast. Go there and recover any plans they might have on the island or on their ship.

column1: Captives at Deatholme^20^Horde^Ghostlands^Apothecary Renzithen^Arcanist Janeda^A Restorative Draught^^^Take Renzithen's Restorative Draught to Deatholme and rescue Apprentice Varnis
column2: Apothecary Enith and Ranger Vedoran. Return to Arcanist Janeda at the Sanctum of the Sun for a reward.^Ah
column3: yes. One of my finest creations. This draught will break most forms of alchemically induced stupor. Side effects include confusion
column4: nausea and - in rare cases - temporary blindness. All much preferable to whatever the Scourge plans to do to those prisoners in Deatholme
column5: if you ask me. Best of luck
column6: brave <class>. You are going to need it.

column1: Writ of Safe Passage^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Guard Didier^Dispatch Commander Metz^^^^Deliver the signed Writ of Safe Passage to Dispatch Commander Metz at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands.^Without the help of adventurers
column2: my caravan would have never made it! Scourge were coming out of the woodwork to try and stop us from getting here. <Guard Didier wipes his brow.> Now we need to wait here for Field Marshal Chambers to arrive. He'll sign your writ of safe passage to take back to Dispatch Commander Metz at Light's Hope Chapel. And <name>
column3: watch what you say around Chambers. He's the 'bite off your head and spit down your wind pipe' type of guy - except that he'll actually do it...

column1: Deliver the Plans to An'telas^16^Horde^Ghostlands^Dame Auriferous^Magister Sylastor^Investigate An'daroth^^Deactivate An'owyn^Deliver the Night Elf Plans to Magister Sylastor at An'telas in the Ghostlands.^You must deliver the recovered night elf plans to An'telas for me. It is to the east
column2: on the southern slopes of Sungraze Peak
column3: just to the northeast of the Sanctum of the Sun. Magister Sylastor is there conducting ongoing studies into the ley-line nexus energy for potential use in our fight against the Scourge. Have him look at these plans to shed some light on what it is that these night elves are up to.

column1: The Traitor's Destruction^21^Horde^Ghostlands^Magister Kaendris^Magister Kaendris^The Farstrider Enclave^^Hero of the Sin'dorei
column2: Friend of the Sin'dorei^Slay Dar'Khan Drathir inside Deatholme and bring his head to Magister Kaendris at the Sanctum of the Sun in the Ghostlands.^Everything we've done in the Ghostlands has been done with the goal of taking back what is rightfully ours. The Scourge have maintained their chokehold on the region for far too long. The time has come for payback
column3: <name>. Thanks to your help and the help of our new allies
column4: the Forsaken
column5: vengeance will soon be ours. He who sought to steal the power of the Sunwell must die. Go to Deatholme
column6: the Scourge stronghold south of the Dead Scar. Bring me Dar'Khan's head and your deeds will go down in history!

column1: Deactivate An'owyn^16^Horde^Ghostlands^Magister Sylastor^Magister Sylastor^^Deliver the Plans to An'telas^^Retrieve the Crystal Controlling Orb and then use it to deactivate the Night Elf Moon Crystal at An'owyn. Then return to Magister Sylastor at An'telas in the Ghostlands.^Their moon crystals are scrying devices -- they're going to spy on us! I know that An'daroth can't provide enough power for that
column2: but An'owyn
column3: directly to the south
column4: most definitely can! From the plans I now have a basic knowledge of how these moon crystals work; enough to shut them down. They're keyed so that they can be turned off. You must go to An'owyn
column5: retrieve the controlling orb from one of the night elves and then use it on the moon crystal to stop them from enacting their plan! Hurry
column6: <class>!

column1: Dar'Khan's Lieutenants^20^Horde^Ghostlands^Magister Idonis^Magister Idonis^The Sanctum of the Sun^^^Magister Idonis wants you to venture into Deatholme to slay Masophet the Black
column2: Jurion the Deceiver
column3: Borgoth the Bloodletter and Mirdoran the Fallen. Report back to him in the Sanctum of the Sun in the Ghostlands after you've completed this task.^The odious traitor
column4: Dar'Khan
column5: has risen to great power among the ranks of the Scourge. His lieutenants command vast armies of undead against our dwindling numbers. Masophet the Black
column6: Jurion the Deceiver
column7: Borgoth the Bloodletter
column8: Mirdoran the Fallen. Learn these names well for in the Ghostlands these Scourge leaders are second only to Dar'Khan himself. Slay them and their mindless armies will be thrown into disarray.

column1: Culinary Crunch^15^Horde^Ghostlands^Master Chef Mouldier^Master Chef Mouldier^^^^Collect 5 Crunchy Spider Legs and return them to Master Chef Mouldier at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^This is intolerable! I have nothing to work with here! Milady asks me to come from Silvermoon City; she deserves cuisine as befits her station. No? But I get here and there is no food. You must go out
column2: <class>
column3: and bring back fresh kills so that I have something to prepare. Dame Auriferous prefers a crunchy texture to her food. There are plenty of spindleweb lurkers to the southwest on the other side of the Dead Scar. Disgusting
column4: I know
column5: but that's what we have to work with.

column1: Report to Magister Kaendris^16^Horde^Ghostlands^Ranger Vynna^Magister Kaendris^The Farstrider Enclave^^^Bring Dar'Khan's Journal to Magister Kaendris at the Sanctum of the Sun in the Ghostlands.^The magisters at the Sanctum of the Sun have made great progress in analyzing the Scourge's weaknesses with the aid of the Forsaken. Magister Kaendris will know what to do with this information. You'll find the Sanctum of the Sun southwest of here. You must hurry
column2: <name>. Dar'Khan is a cunning enemy and watches our every move!

column1: Retaking Windrunner Spire^15^Horde^Ghostlands^High Executor Mavren^High Executor Mavren^^^^Slay 8 Deatholme Acolytes and 10 Fallen Rangers
column2: and return to High Executor Mavren at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^<class>
column3: I want you to reclaim Windrunner Spire! It's an honor
column4: really. Windrunner Spire is the original home of Lady Sylvanas Windrunner
column5: queen of the Forsaken and former ranger-general of the elves. But now it's been overrun by the mindless Scourge. To get there take the road south until it branches. Take the right fork and after crossing the Dead Scar continue southwest. You can't miss it.

column1: Vanquishing Aquantion^13^Horde^Ghostlands^Geranis Whitemorn^Geranis Whitemorn^Forgotten Rituals^^^Geranis Whitemorn wants you to swim to the bottom of the lake east of Suncrown Village and use the Bundle of Medallions on the Altar of Tidal Mastery. Summon and slay the elemental known as Aquantion and return to Geranis.^That willful elemental ended many lives that fateful day when he revolted against us. By calling to the lowly murloc to sabotage our rites he subverted our magic and turned it against us. Show him our thirst for vengeance has not waned! Take these medallions and lay them at the Altar of Tidal Mastery at the bottom of the lake. Aquantion shall immediately answer your summons! Beware
column2: <race>! Without our magic controlling him
column3: his wrath will be unrestrained. Destroy Aquantion so we may rest!

column1: The Lady's Necklace^15^Horde^Ghostlands^The Lady's Necklace^High Executor Mavren^^^Journey to Undercity^Take The Lady's Necklace to High Executor Mavren at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^The necklace shimmers
column2: a remarkable piece of jewelry that doesn't seem to succumb to the gloom that permeates the Ghostlands. Given the inscription
column3: and where you found it
column4: it must be the lost property of Lady Sylvanas Windrunner herself! Perhaps it would be best to first take it to High Executor Mavren at Tranquillien? He seems to be the highest ranking Forsaken in the area and is sure to know what to do with it.

column1: The Twin Ziggurats^17^Horde^Ghostlands^Magister Kaendris^Magister Kaendris^The Farstrider Enclave^^^Travel to the Bleeding Ziggurat and the Howling Ziggurat and recover the Stone of Light and the Stone of Flame. Return to Magister Kaendris at the Sanctum of the Sun after recovering the items.^According to this journal
column2: Dar'Khan promised the Scourge two powerful elven artifacts: the stone of light and the stone of flame. These were imbued with the magical energies of the Sunwell and attuned to have warding powers against the Scourge. The crystals were to be transported to where the Howling Ziggurat and the Bleeding Ziggurat now stand
column3: in the middle of the Dead Scar. If they're still held there
column4: we need to recover them. Their power will be greatly useful in our struggle against the enemy.

column1: Craftsman's Writ - Dense Weightstone^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Craftsman's Writ - Dense Weightstone^Packmaster Stonebruiser^^^^Deliver 120 Dense Weightstones and the Craftsman's Writ - Dense Weightstone - to Packmaster Stonebruiser at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands.^The bearer of this writ is entitled to payment in the form of an insignia of their choice upon completion of the contracted work order. Work Order BS-091: 120 Dense Weightstones. All filled orders should be delivered to Packmaster Stonebruiser at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands. Contract is null and void if tampered with or damaged. -Dispatch Commander Metz
column2: The Argent Dawn

column1: Craftsman's Writ - Imperial Plate Chest^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Craftsman's Writ - Imperial Plate Chest^Packmaster Stonebruiser^^^^Deliver 3 Imperial Plate Chests and the Craftsman's Writ - Imperial Plate Chest - to Packmaster Stonebruiser at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands.^The bearer of this writ is entitled to payment in the form of an insignia of their choice upon completion of the contracted work order. column1: Journey to Undercity^15^Horde^Undercity^High Executor Mavren^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner^^The Lady's Necklace^Delivery to the Sepulcher^Take The Lady's Necklace to Lady Sylvanas Windrunner at the Royal Quarter in Undercity.^This is quite extraordinary! It appears to be a gift to Lady Sylvanas Windrunner from her sister
column2: Alleria! You must take it to her in the Undercity at once! The lady holds court in the Royal Quarter. To get there
column3: use the orb of translocation in the Inner Sanctum of Sunfury Spire in Silvermoon City to cross over to the Undercity. Once there
column4: take the elevator ride down into the city proper. Use your maps if you need help finding the Royal Quarter.

column1: Delivery to the Sepulcher^15^Blood Elf^Silverpine Forest^Ambassador Sunsorrow^Advisor Sorrelon^^Journey to Undercity^^Deliver the Sealed Sin'dorei Orders to Advisor Sorrelon at the Sepulcher in Silverpine Forest.^You have stirred the lady's heart
column2: though it no longer beats. However
column3: I have instructions that must be delivered to the Sepulcher in Silverpine Forest. Advisor Sorrelon represents us to the Forsaken there. The shortest route
column4: barring the use of their flying bats
column5: is to leave Undercity and take the road south. Follow the signposts. Finding the place shouldn't be difficult. Brace yourself
column6: though; the Sepulcher itself is a dilapidated crypt. These Forsaken are certainly odd creatures.

column1: Trouble at the Underlight Mines^14^Horde^Ghostlands^Deathstalker Maltendis^Deathstalker Maltendis^^^^Slay 8 Blackpaw Gnolls
column2: 6 Blackpaw Scavengers and 4 Blackpaw Shaman
column3: and return to Deathstalker Maltendis at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^The Underlight Mines to the southwest have been overrun by a clan of gnolls calling themselves the Blackpaw. I don't need to remind you how important those mines are to us as a strategic asset in our ongoing campaign here in the Ghostlands! Take the south road out of town and follow the fork to the right. Just past the ziggurat on the right there will be a short dirt path to the west. Follow it. The ore must flow!

column1: Investigate the Amani Catacombs^17^Horde^Ghostlands^Advisor Valwyn^Advisor Valwyn^^^^Investigate the Amani Catacombs and burn 10 Mummified Troll Remains
column2: then return to Advisor Valwyn at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^<class>
column3: our sources tell us that the trolls buried in the Amani Catacombs inside Sungraze Peak have been rising from the dead. Dame Auriferous would have you investigate these catacombs and put to the torch any of the unanimated remains you come across so as to prevent any more of these creatures from rising. The fastest way there is to head north out of town and then take the first fork to the right. This will put you on the north side of the peak
column4: so look to the south for the entrance.

column1: Troll Juju^17^Horde^Ghostlands^Deathstalker Maltendis^Deathstalker Maltendis^^^^Collect 8 Troll Juju and return them to Deathstalker Maltendis at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^The corpses of trolls buried inside the Amani Catacombs have been rising from the dead! I want you to go there and bring back proof of their final demise. Some of these mummy trolls
column2: and their living counterparts
column3: carry juju; glowing objects that house an unknown power source. It's probably what is animating them! The catacombs lie within Sungraze Peak
column4: directly to the east. I am told that the easiest way in lies on the north face of the mountain. See to it
column5: <class>!

column1: Underlight Ore Samples^14^Horde^Ghostlands^Apprentice Shatharia^Magister Quallestis^^^^Collect 6 Underlight Ore and deliver them to Magister Quallestis at the Sanctum of the Sun in the Ghostlands.^I was sent here from the Sanctum of the Sun to collect some ore samples
column2: but the gnolls have overrun the place! It's going to be my head on a platter if I don't get those samples to the magister soon. Maybe you could help
column3: <class>? You can find the ore in the tin and copper veins here
column4: and the gnolls are carrying it around
column5: too. When you have enough
column6: take it to Magister Quallestis at the Sanctum of the Sun directly to the east. Go across the Dead Scar and you'll find the sanctum just south of Sungraze Peak.

column1: The Savage Guard - Arcanum of Protection^60^All^Zul'Gurub^Zanza the Restless^Zanza the Restless^^^^Zanza the Restless in Zul'Gurub wants an Arcanum of Protection.^Zanza can create many ancient troll enchantments with proper components! Have you heard of the Savage Guard? No
column2: of course you haven't. Your mind is addled with the inferior elven magic. Bring me an arcanum of elven creation so that I may destroy the aberration. Do this and the Savage Guard will be yours.

column2: the Ice Guard. It is a thin sheen of protective magic that covers certain pieces of equipment. Those that do battle with creatures of frost and ice will gain increased protection from their attacks by using the Ice Guard. As with all things the Wrathcaster creates
column3: there is a price - a price that I will not lower
column4: regardless of how much you whimper. Interested?

column1: Escape from the Catacombs^17^Horde^Ghostlands^Ranger Lilatha^Captain Helios^^^^Escort Ranger Lilatha to Captain Helios at Farstrider Enclave in the Ghostlands.^These trolls ambushed me and have been keeping me in this cage. I think they're planning to sacrifice me! Help me get out of here! The lock on the cage isn't that complex... I just can't get to it from this side. Please escort me back to the Farstrider Enclave. I'm sure Captain Helios will reward you
column2: and you'll have my undying gratitude!

column1: The Shadow Guard^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Mataus the Wrathcaster^Mataus the Wrathcaster^^^^Mataus the Wrathcaster at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands wants 10 Insignia of the Crusade and 30 gold.^A creation of genius! Much like the Ice Guard
column2: the Shadow Guard employs a thin sheen of protective magic that covers certain pieces of equipment. And like the Ice Guard
column3: the Shadow Guard is going to cost you a good amount of money. <Mataus holds his hand out and rubs his fingers together.> Interested?

column1: Shadowpine Weaponry^18^Horde^Ghostlands^Captain Helios^Captain Helios^^^^Collect 3 Headhunter Axes
column2: 3 Shadowcaster Maces
column3: 3 Catlord Claws and 3 Hexxer Staves. Return them to Captain Helios at Farstrider Enclave in the Ghostlands.^<class>
column4: I want you to kill as many Shadowpine trolls as you can. We need their numbers greatly reduced before we can shift our attention toward Deatholme. And while you're at it
column5: we might as well kill two birds with one stone
column6: so bring me back a load of their weapons. Better that they not go to waste
column7: and we can use them in the fight against the Scourge. Hit their camps hard to the east and the south at Zeb'Tela and Zeb'Nowa.

column1: Bring Me Kel'gash's Head!^20^Horde^Ghostlands^Wanted Poster: Kel'gash the Wicked^Captain Helios^^^^Return the Head of Kel'gash the Wicked to Captain Helios at the Farstrider Enclave in the Ghostlands.^WANTED: Bring the head of Kel'gash the Wicked
column2: chieftain of the Shadowpine trolls
column3: to Captain Helios. No questions asked. Kel'gash is known to dwell somewhere to the south in Zeb'Nowa.  REWARD: Yes
column4: but no advances!

column1: Rotting Hearts^16^Horde^Ghostlands^Magistrix Aminel^Magistrix Aminel^^^More Rotting Hearts^Bring back 10 Rotting Hearts to Magistrix Aminel in Tranquillien.^I hear the Amani trolls eat their enemies' hearts to steal their strength. They might just be on to something
column2: <name>. With the proper treatment
column3: the hearts of the unliving can produce potent elixirs. Hunt down the zombies that roam the Dead Scar and bring me their hearts. I'll show you the kind of enhancement we can perform to your physical prowess against the undead.

column1: Spinal Dust^18^Horde^Ghostlands^Magistrix Aminel^Magistrix Aminel^^^More Spinal Dust^Bring back 10 Spinal Dusts to Magistrix Aminel in Tranquillien.^The dark energy that flows through the bodies of reanimated skeletons tends to accumulate primarily in their spine. I've discovered a method of instilling this energy into a potion that boosts our magical abilities against the undead. Bring me some spinal dust and I'll be glad to provide you with a sample. You'll find an ample number of skeletons wandering the Dead Scar
column2: west of here.

column1: War on Deatholme^20^Horde^Ghostlands^Magister Idonis^Magister Idonis^The Sanctum of the Sun^^A Restorative Draught^Slay 5 Eyes of Dar'khan
column2: 6 Nerubis Centurions and 6 Wailers in Deatholme and return to Magister Idonis at the Sanctum of the Sun in the Ghostlands.^If you seek to aid our cause there is no better place to start than here and no better time to do it than now. By rebuilding the Sanctum of the Sun we've raised a banner of defiance in front of our enemy's seat of power: Deatholme. Go forth and fight the hordes of undead that inhabit the vile Scourge fortress.

column1: Superior Armaments of Battle - Friend of the Dawn^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Quartermaster Miranda Breechlock^Quartermaster Miranda Breechlock^^^^For 30 Insignias of the Dawn and 30 Insignias of the Crusade you may choose an item from the Argent Dawn's treasure cache.^Greetings
column2: friend. Have you insignias of the Dawn or the Crusade that you would like to redeem for items of power? I must warn you; purchases made at a friendly reputation with the Dawn come with a hefty surcharge. I would advise that you gain a better reputation with the Dawn before moving forward with your plans.

column5: after all
column6: a crook. In Disdain

column1: The Keeper's Call^1^All^Scourge Invasion^A Letter from the Keeper of the Rolls^Keeper of the Rolls^^^^Take the Letter from the Keeper of the Rolls to him at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands.^<name>
column2: In times past you have served the interests of the Argent Dawn
column3: always to the best of your abilities. Now
column4: once again
column5: we sound the clarion call in our time of greatest need. <name>
column6: please report to the Keeper of the Rolls at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands if you are willing to aid us once more.

column1: A Humble Offering^60^All^Silithus^Aurel Goldleaf^Aurel Goldleaf^^^^Aurel Goldleaf at Cenarion Hold in Silithus wants you to bring her 1 Abyssal Scepter. You must also be Honored with the Cenarion Circle.^Ishnu-alah
column2: <race>. Show me proof of the demise of a Lord of the Abyssal Council and I shall reward you with an item that should aid you in your battles against the Qiraji.

column1: Frame of Atiesh^60^All^Legendary^Frame of Atiesh^Anachronos^Frame of Atiesh^^^Find someone that will help you in recovering the last two pieces of the staff and ridding it of evil.^With the frame formed
column2: Atiesh is nearly whole. Only the head and base of the staff are now missing. There is also a minor issue regarding the staff being a conduit for Sargeras's evil. Find someone that can assist you in locating the remaining pieces and exorcising the evil from the staff.

column1: Atiesh
column2: the Befouled Greatstaff^60^All^Legendary^Anachronos^Anachronos^Frame of Atiesh^^Atiesh
column3: Greatstaff of the Guardian
column4: Atiesh
column5: Greatstaff of the Guardian
column6: Atiesh
column7: Greatstaff of the Guardian
column8: Atiesh
column9: Greatstaff of the Guardian^Anachronos at the Caverns of Time in Tanaris wants the Staff Head of Atiesh and the Base of Atiesh.^You question why you are still alive. After all
column10: you have in your possession an item of great evil. The answer is not clear
column11: <name>. I only do as I must. Kel'Thuzad sits atop his throne in Naxxramas
column12: plotting... He seeks that which you hold and holds that which you seek. As for the base of the staff; the dwarf
column13: Brann Bronzebeard
column14: held it when he entered Ahn'Qiraj. He has left Ahn'Qiraj but the base of Atiesh remains. Should you succeed in recovering the pieces

column1: Defending Fairbreeze Village^9^Horde^Eversong Woods^Ranger Sareyn^Ranger Sareyn^^^Runewarden Deryan^Slay 4 Rotlimb Marauders and 4 Darkwraiths and return to Ranger Sareyn at Fairbreeze Village in Eversong Woods.^We've experienced a marked increase in Scourge attacks
column2: <name>. Our defenses are barely holding and there's no sign of reinforcements from Silvermoon City. Lend us a hand in defending the village by thinning the numbers of the undead roaming the Dead Scar nearby.

column1: Runewarden Deryan^10^Horde^Eversong Woods^Ranger Sareyn^Runewarden Deryan^Runewarden Deryan^Defending Fairbreeze Village^^Speak to Runewarden Deryan in Eversong Woods
column2: near the border with the Ghostlands.^This increase in Scourge attacks leads me to believe there might be a malfunction at one of the protective runestones at the border with the Ghostlands. We used these ancient stones to protect us against the undead. Most of them were destroyed or lost after the attack on the Sunwell. Follow the road south
column3: towards the Ghostlands
column4: and look to the west for a small path. You will find Runewarden Deryan by the runestone nearby; he will know whether anything's wrong.

column1: The Wayward Apprentice^9^Horde^Eversong Woods^Magistrix Landra Dawnstrider^Apprentice Mirveda^The Wayward Apprentice^^^Speak to Apprentice Mirveda at the East Sanctum in Eversong Woods.^Thank you for your help
column2: <name>. While I get things back in order here
column3: I'd like to ask you for a favor. One of my former apprentices embarked in a very dangerous line of research. She journeyed to the East Sanctum
column4: in the middle of the Dead Scar. I worry for her well-being. See if you can find her and convince her to return to her senses.

column1: Research Notes^9^Horde^Eversong Woods^Apprentice Mirveda^Magistrix Landra Dawnstrider^Unexpected Results^^Saltheril's Haven^Deliver the Research Notes to Magistrix Landra Dawnstrider at Fairbreeze Village in Eversong Woods.^As discouraging as my research results are
column2: they still contain valuable data. I must have a magister review my work before it is taken seriously. Please
column3: take these notes to Magistrix Landra Dawnstrider at Fairbreeze Village
column4: west of here.

column1: Fairbreeze Village^7^Horde^Eversong Woods^Aeldon Sunbrand^Ranger Degolien^Fairbreeze Village^The Dwarven Spy^^Speak to Ranger Degolien at Fairbreeze Village in Eversong Woods.^I have another task for you
column2: <name>. Ranger Degolien was sent to Fairbreeze Village to find out more about a Wretched attack on a nearby shipyard. He has requested reinforcements which we cannot yet provide. Seek him out and grant him whatever aid you can. Fairbreeze Village can be reached by following the road out of Falconwing Square all the way towards the south. Good luck
column3: <name>.

column1: Atiesh
column2: Greatstaff of the Guardian^60^All^Legendary^Anachronos^Anachronos^^Atiesh
column3: the Befouled Greatstaff^^Anachronos at the Caverns of Time in Tanaris wants you to take Atiesh
column4: Greatstaff of the Guardian to Stratholme and use it on Consecrated Earth. Defeat the entity that is exorcised from the staff and return to him.^This final task will be the most difficult of all
column5: <name>. You have faced and defeated both an Old God and the Lich King's General
column6: but now you must face the hand of Sargeras. Take the staff to Stratholme. It is there that you will find a piece of consecrated earth: ground where the greatest knights of Lordaeron were murdered. Place the befouled staff upon the holy ground and prepare for an entity of immense power to break from within... Defeat the demonic being that controls the staff and return to me.

column1: The Scorched Grove^10^Horde^Eversong Woods^Ardeyn Riverwind^Larianna Riverwind^The Scorched Grove^^^Find Larianna Riverwind near the Scorched Grove in the southwest of Eversong Woods.^A foul taint in the soil precedes the expansion of the Scourge into a new area. The protective runestones along the border with the Ghostlands have warded the land against this taint in the past. The westernmost runestone was destroyed during a Scourge attack
column2: which forced us to burn the ground around it to prevent the taint from spreading. My sister
column3: Larianna Riverwind
column4: watches over the Scorched Grove. Go find her; she might have some work for you.

column1: Investigate the Scourge of Stormwind^6^Alliance^Scourge Invasion^Lieutenant Orrin^Lieutenant Orrin^^^^Collect three Dim Necrotic Stones from the Scourge outside Stormwind and investigate the glowing runic circles near their encampment.^The Lich King has sent his undead upon our very doorstep; we cannot remain idle! Surely you will step up to defend Stormwind from these accursed invaders? There are strange runic circles outside
column2: glowing with the same energy that surrounds the undead and the Necropolis above. They have significance
column3: I'm certain
column4: and I want you to find out what. Thin the numbers of those aberrations while you're at it; bring me proof of their death along with your results
column5: and I will reward you. Go!

column1: Investigate the Scourge of the Undercity^8^Horde^Scourge Invasion^Lieutenant Rukag^Lieutenant Rukag^^^^Collect three Dim Necrotic Stones from the Scourge outside the Undercity and investigate the glowing runic circles near their encampment.^The Lich King has sent his undead upon our very doorstep; we cannot remain idle! column3: I'm certain
column4: and I want you to find out what. Thin the numbers of those aberrations while you're at it; bring me proof of their death along with your results
column5: and I will reward you. Go!

column1: Atiesh
column2: Greatstaff of the Guardian^60^All^Legendary^Anachronos^Anachronos^^Atiesh
column3: the Befouled Greatstaff^^Anachronos at the Caverns of Time in Tanaris wants you to take Atiesh
column4: Greatstaff of the Guardian to Stratholme and use it on Consecrated Earth. Defeat the entity that is exorcised from the staff and return to him.^This final task will be the most difficult of all
column5: <name>. You have faced and defeated both an Old God and the Lich King's General
column6: but now you must face the hand of Sargeras. Take the staff to Stratholme. It is there that you will find a piece of consecrated earth: ground where the greatest knights of Lordaeron were murdered. Place the befouled staff upon the holy ground and prepare for an entity of immense power to break from within... Defeat the demonic being that controls the staff and return to me.

column1: Atiesh
column2: Greatstaff of the Guardian^60^All^Legendary^Anachronos^Anachronos^^Atiesh
column3: the Befouled Greatstaff^^Anachronos at the Caverns of Time in Tanaris wants you to take Atiesh
column4: Greatstaff of the Guardian to Stratholme and use it on Consecrated Earth. Defeat the entity that is exorcised from the staff and return to him.^This final task will be the most difficult of all
column5: <name>. You have faced and defeated both an Old God and the Lich King's General
column6: but now you must face the hand of Sargeras. Take the staff to Stratholme. It is there that you will find a piece of consecrated earth: ground where the greatest knights of Lordaeron were murdered. Place the befouled staff upon the holy ground and prepare for an entity of immense power to break from within... Defeat the demonic being that controls the staff and return to me.

column1: Spirits of the Drowned^12^Horde^Ghostlands^Ranger Krenn'an^Ranger Krenn'an^^^^Ranger Krenn'an
column2: at the Farstrider Enclave in the Ghostlands
column3: wants you to kill 8 Vengeful Apparitions and 8 Ravening Apparitions in the nearby lake.^The lake to the north has been haunted by the ghosts of my ancestors for as long as I can remember
column4: <name>. The poor souls were victims of a tragic incident in which scores of them drowned at the bottom of the lake. The details of the event are mostly forgotten
column5: but their haunting cries serve as a constant reminder of their curse. If you're up to the task
column6: I want you to go to the lake and put an end to their suffering
column7: <name>. You will have my gratitude as well as theirs... I'm sure.

column1: A Little Dash of Seasoning^19^Horde^Ghostlands^Apothecary Venustus^Apothecary Venustus^^^^Poison the Troll foodstuff at the camps in Zeb'Nowa and then return to Apothecary Venustus at the Farstrider Enclave in the Ghostlands.^I'm on loan to the Farstriders in an attempt to help with their troll difficulties. I believe that I have a solution to their problem. At my disposal are a number of potent poisons. The trolls
column2: as you know
column3: are living creatures and therefore must eat. If we combine my poison with their food... well
column4: I'm sure that the results will be entertaining! Care to help rid us of the Shadowpine trolls at Zeb'Nowa to the south? The camp straddles both the north and south sides of the road to Zul'Aman.

column1: Attack on Zeb'Tela^18^Horde^Ghostlands^Farstrider Solanna^Farstrider Solanna^Attack on Zeb'Tela^^^Kill 8 Shadowpine Shadowcasters and 8 Shadowpine Headhunters
column2: and return to Farstrider Solanna at Farstrider Enclave in the Ghostlands.^Our resources are spread pretty thin here
column3: <class>
column4: so your help is going to be invaluable. The captain has tasked me with overseeing the harassment of the local Shadowpine troll camps. We have a policy of keeping them off balance until the day when we can launch a brutal offensive to wipe them out. Until then
column5: we need all of the volunteers that we can get so that those Shadowpine troll numbers are decreased. Think you could head east to Zeb'Tela and hurt them a little?

column1: Assault on Zeb'Nowa^19^Horde^Ghostlands^Farstrider Solanna^Farstrider Solanna^Attack on Zeb'Tela^^^Kill 10 Shadowpine Catlords and 10 Shadowpine Hexxers
column2: and return to Farstrider Solanna at the Farstrider Enclave in the Ghostlands.^Time for something a little more challenging. Zeb'Nowa
column3: to the south
column4: is where the more powerful Shadowpine trolls make their home. In our continuing effort to keep the troll numbers to a minimum I'm dispatching you to go down there and assail them by whatever means you have at your disposal. What do you say
column5: <name>? Ready to deal with some more trolls?

column1: You Survived!^1^Draenei^Azuremyst Isle^Megelon^Proenitus^You Survived!^^^Speak with Proenitus at the Crash Site in Ammen Vale.^Nevermind my injuries
column2: <brother /sister>. It's a miracle that any of us are alive! It didn't look like you'd pull through; you've been in suspension for weeks. Something happened and the Exodar crashed. Many have died. But I'm relieved that you are alive
column3: <name>. With you leading our efforts
column4: I'm sure we'll get to safety soon! Proenitus asked me to send you to him when you awoke. He's waiting for you at the bottom of the hill. Just follow the path southwest.

column1: Replenishing the Healing Crystals^1^Draenei^Azuremyst Isle^Proenitus^Proenitus^You Survived!^^Urgent Delivery!^Acquire 8 Vials of Moth Blood from the nearby Vale Moths and give them to Proenitus at the Crash Site in Ammen Vale.^Our immediate concern is the depleted state of our healing crystals. We must replenish them quickly! Unfortunately
column2: the only way to do this at this point is to extract the blood from the local vale moths. Their blood will make for a suitable substitute. The moths can be found in many places around the vale
column3: but they are mostly concentrated in the northwest.

column1: Clearing the Way^18^Horde^Ghostlands^Apprentice Vor'el^Apprentice Vor'el^^^^Apprentice Vor'el at Andilien Estate in the Ghostlands wants you to slay 10 Greater Spindlewebs and 10 Ghostclaw Ravagers.^Magister Kaendris sent me down here to clear the area of any hostile wildlife. Once this area is secured
column2: the magisters plan to turn it into some sort of advance outpost against the Scourge. Now if there's one thing I've learned as an apprentice it's to delegate responsibility - especially in matters that endanger one's life! If you're interested
column3: I'll pay you well to kill the greater spindlewebs and ghostclaw ravagers to the west and south of here.

column1: The Farstrider Enclave^16^Horde^Ghostlands^Magister Kaendris^Ranger Vynna^The Farstrider Enclave^^^Magister Kaendris
column2: at the Sanctum of the Sun
column3: wants you to talk to Ranger Vynna at the Farstrider Enclave in the Ghostlands.^Magisters and Farstriders may not see eye to eye all the time
column4: <name>. When it comes to Dar'Khan
column5: however
column6: we're all in agreement that a way must be found to defeat him and his legions. Ranger Vynna
column7: at the Farstrider Enclave northeast of here
column8: has come across important information regarding our enemy. Speak to her and see if you can be of assistance.

column1: Rescue the Survivors!^2^Draenei^Azuremyst Isle^Zalduun^Zalduun^^Urgent Delivery!^^Use your Gift of the Naaru ability on one of the Draenei Survivors spread throughout Ammen Vale
column2: then return to Zalduun at the Crash Site in Ammen Vale.^The healing crystals are replenished
column3: but that is not the only way we can help the injured. All draenei can tap the gift of the Naaru to heal. You must use this ability to heal one of the crash survivors. You'll find most of the survivors in the areas to the west and northwest
column4: but the crash scattered us all over the vale. The survivors have suffered from exposure to the irradiated power crystals
column5: so you should be able to find them by the red glow that surround them. You must save them
column6: <name>.

column1: Cracked Necrotic Crystal^1^Alliance^Scourge Invasion^Faint Necrotic Crystal^Lieutenant Orrin^^^^Bring the Cracked Necrotic Crystal to Lieutenant Orrin outside the gates of Stormwind.^On the corpse of the fallen abomination
column2: you discover a cracked crystal
column3: slowly pulsing with necrotic energy.

column1: What Must Be Done...^2^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Botanist Taerix^Botanist Taerix^Botanist Taerix^^^Gather 10 Lasher Samples and return them to Botanist Taerix at the Crash Site in Ammen Vale.^The nearby lake has been contaminated by one of the ship's power crystals. Many of the plants and animals of Ammen Vale have been mutated because of this. I have a theory on how to heal the lake
column2: but I must have samples from the mutated lashers for analysis. They can be found to the west in the Ammen Fields. Will you help me
column3: <class>?

column1: Healing the Lake^3^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Botanist Taerix^Botanist Taerix^Botanist Taerix^^Vindicator Aldar^Disperse the Neutralizing Agent at the Irradiated Power Crystal
column2: then return to Botanist Taerix at the Crash Site in Ammen Vale.^Thank goodness
column3: I think it'll work! I have an agent for you to spread at Silverline Lake to the south. It will neutralize the effects of the irradiated ship's power crystal that fell there. Swim out and scatter the neutralizing agent near it. Don't worry
column4: you won't be exposed long enough to become irradiated.

column1: Letter from the Front^45^All^Scourge Invasion^A Torn Letter^Keeper of the Rolls^^^^Take the Torn Letter to the Keeper of the Rolls at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands.^You found this letter on one of the many Scourge minions you've slain. From its appearance and smell
column2: it has been with the undead for some time. Perhaps someone at Light's Hope Chapel would be interested in examining it further...

column1: Note from the Front^45^All^Scourge Invasion^A Careworn Note^Keeper of the Rolls^^^^Take the Careworn Note to the Keeper of the Rolls at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands.^You found this letter on one of the many Scourge minions you've slain. From its appearance and smell
column2: it has been with the undead for some time. Perhaps someone at Light's Hope Chapel would be interested in examining it further...

column1: Page from the Front^45^All^Scourge Invasion^A Ragged Page^Keeper of the Rolls^^^^Take the Ragged Page to the Keeper of the Rolls at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands.^You found this letter on one of the many Scourge minions you've slain. From its appearance and smell
column2: it has been with the undead for some time. Perhaps someone at Light's Hope Chapel would be interested in examining it further...

column1: Envelope from the Front^45^All^Scourge Invasion^A Bloodstained Envelope^Keeper of the Rolls^^^^Take the Bloodstained Envelope to the Keeper of the Rolls at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands.^You found this letter on one of the many Scourge minions you've slain. From its appearance and smell
column2: it has been with the undead for some time. Perhaps someone at Light's Hope Chapel would be interested in examining it further...

column1: Missive from the Front^45^All^Scourge Invasion^A Crumpled Missive^Keeper of the Rolls^^^^Take the Crumpled Missive to the Keeper of the Rolls at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands.^You found this letter on one of the many Scourge minions you've slain. From its appearance and smell
column2: it has been with the undead for some time. Perhaps someone at Light's Hope Chapel would be interested in examining it further...

column1: Inoculation^4^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Vindicator Aldar^Vindicator Aldar^Vindicator Aldar^^The Missing Scout^Use the Inoculating Crystal on 6 Nestlewood Owlkin. Then return to Vindicator Aldar at the Crash Site in Ammen Vale.^Zhanaa needs our help to salvage parts from the Exodar. Taerix prepared an inoculum that can be given to the Nestlewood owlkin that live in the area of a lot of the salvage. Just get close to the unaffected ones and use the crystal on them. Unfortunately
column2: you'll have to kill the others. You'll find the owlkin at Nestlewood Thicket and Nestlewood Hills to the southeast.

column1: Document from the Front^45^All^Scourge Invasion^A Smudged Document^Keeper of the Rolls^^^^Take the Smudged Document to the Keeper of the Rolls at Light's Hope Chapel in the Eastern Plaguelands.^You found this letter on one of the many Scourge minions you've slain. From its appearance and smell
column2: it has been with the undead for some time. Perhaps someone at Light's Hope Chapel would be interested in examining it further...

column1: Spare Parts^4^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Technician Zhanaa^Technician Zhanaa^^^^Collect 4 Emitter Spare Parts and then return to Technician Zhanaa at the Crash Site in Ammen Vale.^We managed to recover a damaged holographic emitter from the crash. If we repair it
column2: we'll have a chance to find other survivors outside of Ammen Vale. There were devices from the ship that could be salvaged for spare parts in the area
column3: but the local owlkin carried them off before we could get to them. <name>
column4: you must go south to Nestlewood Thicket and Hills to find the spare parts.

column1: The Missing Scout^5^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Vindicator Aldar^Tolaan^The Missing Scout^Inoculation^^Find and speak with Tolaan at Shadow Ridge in Ammen Vale.^We now have several separate confirmations of unusual activity up on the Shadow Ridge. This is disturbing; we thought that the scouting missions already undertaken had been thorough. One of my scouts hasn't reported back yet. <class>
column2: I need you to head southwest to the other side of Silverline Lake and find Tolaan
column3: and see what has delayed him.

column1: Faint Necrotic Crystal^1^Horde^Scourge Invasion^Faint Necrotic Crystal^Lieutenant Rukag^^^^Bring the Faint Necrotic Crystal to Lieutenant Rukag in the courtyard of the Undercity.^On the corpse of the fallen wight
column2: you find a crystal faintly radiating necrotic energy.

column1: Blood Elf Spy^5^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Tolaan^Vindicator Aldar^The Missing Scout^^The Emitter^Slay Surveyor Candress and then inform Vindicator Aldar at the Crash Site in Ammen Vale.^I have a plan. We must kill their leader. Without their master
column2: perhaps they will retreat to regroup. We just need to buy time until the repairs are completed. Then Vindicator Aldar must know of this. Kill the surveyor
column3: then return and tell him what we've found.

column1: The Emitter^5^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Vindicator Aldar^Technician Zhanaa^^Blood Elf Spy^Travel to Azure Watch^Speak with Technician Zhanaa at the Crash Site in Ammen Vale.^<name>
column2: while you were out investigating the Shadow Ridge
column3: Zhanaa here has been going on about the holographic emitter. You might want to speak with her.

column1: Travel to Azure Watch^5^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Technician Zhanaa^Technician Dyvuun^^The Emitter^^Speak with Technician Dyvuun at Azure Watch on Azuremyst Isle.^By all that is good
column2: <name>
column3: you must go at once to this Azure Watch and speak with Dyvuun! There is a path that leads west off of this tiny isle. Follow it and cross the Crystalbrook River to arrive on the larger part of the isle. Continue to follow the path and you should find Azure Watch. See if you can convince them to send us some aid and supplies. The rest of us will follow when we can. Thank you
column4: we wouldn't have made it without you!

column1: Word from Azure Watch^5^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Aeun^Caregiver Chellan^^^^Speak with Caregiver Chellan at Azure Watch on Azuremyst Isle.^<class>! A couple mutated beasts jumped me and my leg is injured. I was sent on a scouting mission from Azure Watch after we received word from Zhanaa. Please
column2: could you go speak with Caregiver Chellan in my stead? She needs to know how many people to expect in Azure Watch. Just cross the Crystalbrook River here and continue following the road until you get to Azure Watch. Be sure to ask her for a place for yourself to stay in.

column1: Anok'suten^11^Horde^Ghostlands^Dying Blood Elf^Arcanist Vandril^^Return to Arcanist Vandril^^Slay Anok'suten and return to Arcanist Vandril at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^Come closer
column2: I am ... dying. I was sent here ... to slay these Nerubians
column3: but Vandril didn't ... know that they have a leader. <The dying blood elf coughs up a good amount of blood.> You must find and ... slay Anok'suten. Get help. She wanders around ... Suncrown Village.

column1: The Forsaken^10^Blood Elf^Ghostlands^Arcanist Vandril^High Executor Mavren^The Forsaken^^Goods from Silvermoon City
column2: Return to Arcanist Vandril^Speak with High Executor Mavren at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^I know it seems strange
column3: but these Forsaken are here to help. You should speak with their leader
column4: High Executor Mavren. He's in the tower on the west side of town. And
column5: <class>
column6: when you're done talking with him return to me; I have something dire that needs to be dealt with immediately!

column1: Hero of the Sin'dorei^21^Blood Elf^Ghostlands^Magister Kaendris^Lor'themar Theron^Hero of the Sin'dorei^The Traitor's Destruction^^Take Dar'Khan's Head to Lor'themar Theron in Silvermoon City.^This is the beginning of a new chapter in the history of our race
