column2: <name>. Our lands will be reclaimed and we shall cement our bond with Sylvanas and her allies. Take the traitor's head to Regent Lord Lor'themar Theron in Silvermoon City. He'll be eager to hear the news.

column1: The Forsaken^10^Orc
column2: Undead
column3: ^Ghostlands^Arcanist Vandril^High Executor Mavren^The Forsaken^^Return to Arcanist Vandril^Speak with High Executor Mavren at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^I know it seems strange
column4: but the Forsaken are here to help. You should speak with their leader
column5: High Executor Mavren. He's in the tower on the west side of town. And
column6: <class>
column7: when you're done talking with him return to me; I have something dire that needs to be dealt with immediately!

column1: The Great Fissure^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Ranger Captain Venn'ren^Ranger Captain Venn'ren^Falcon Watch^^^Ranger Captain Venn'ren at Falcon Watch wants you to slay 8 Stonescythe Whelps and 3 Stonescythe Alphas at the Great Fissure
column2: east of Falcon Watch.^We're dangerously close to becoming fenced in by Alliance forces. With the influx of sin'dorei pilgrims from Azeroth
column3: we must establish a route that's safe from our enemies' prying eyes. I've given it some thought and have arrived at a solution. We're to establish a secret path through the Great Fissure. Yes
column4: even though the area is crawling with brutal rock flayers
column5: they are merely beasts and can be taught to fear us. I want you to go and kill a good number of them. They shall learn fear.

column1: A Hasty Departure^61^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Far Seer Regulkut^Grelag^A Hasty Departure^^^Far Seer Regulkut wants you to track down her student Grelag.^Greetings
column2: <name>. Outland is a perilous place
column3: as many of our expedition quickly learned. I'm afraid young Grelag may have learned that lesson firsthand. Grelag is a promising student
column4: but he lacks patience! He eagerly studies the history of his people
column5: but he sometimes forgets the threats of the present day. He departed for the Spinebreaker Post
column6: ignorant of the Legion and fel orc presences. I fear something may have happened to him.

column1: Preparing the Salve^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Grelag^Grelag^A Hasty Departure^^^Gather 12 Hellfire Spineleaf plants for a salve and return to Grelag at Spinebreaker Post.^Just as Zeth'Gor came into view
column2: a Legion patrol caught sight of me. I ran
column3: hoping to duck into one of the towers in the distance
column4: but one of their felhounds caught up with me and nearly hamstrung me! I managed to escape
column5: but my leg is in terrible shape. Stone Guard Ambelan found me and brought me here. Now
column6: I have to find a way to tend to my leg. Spineleaf grows in and around the Valley of Bones to the north . A salve made from it will dull the pain enough for me to travel.

column1: Ravager Egg Roundup^61^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Legassi^Legassi^Ravager Egg Roundup^^^Retrieve 12 Ravager Eggs for Legassi at the Zeppelin Crash in Hellfire Peninsula.^I'm starving! There's irony in that
column2: wouldn't you say? A starving cook? <Legassi laughs half-heartedly and taps a folded piece of parchment he has in his pocket.> According to this tourist map we were following - before we were so rudely shot down - there's an area to the southwest
column3: near Terokkar Forest. It's called the Razorthorn Trail
column4: and supposedly it's brimming with delicious ravager eggs! I could cook up quite a feast if only someone were brave enough to go down there and get me some!

column1: Voidwalkers Gone Wild^61^All^Hellfire Peninsula^"Screaming" Screed Luckheed^"Screaming" Screed Luckheed^In Case of Emergency...^^^Bring 10 Condensed Voidwalker Essences to "Screaming" Screed Luckheed at the Zeppelin Crash.^Even if I can get the zeppelin's frame repaired
column2: I'll have to find something else to power the engine. I'm all out of fuel and there's no place to fill up around here! To the south of us is an area of broken land called the Warp Fields. It's full of rogue and uncontrolled voidwalkers
column3: but I like to think of them as walking batteries. If you can bring me enough of their essence
column4: I can convert the zeppelin's engine to run on it. Five gold says I'll even get better mileage out of it
column5: too!

column1: Darnassian Intrusions^6^Horde^Eversong Woods^Aeldon Sunbrand^Ley-Keeper Velania^Report to Aeldon Sunbrand^^^Travel to the West Sanctum
column2: southwest of Falconwing Square and defeat any intruders present there. Report your findings to Ley-Keeper Velania.^Besides the constant threat that the Wretched represent
column3: I also have to deal with all kind of fictitious reports of night elf sightings. Though most reports are unfounded
column4: one recent incident demands further investigation. The West Sanctum
column5: one of our primary energy sources
column6: has suffered a terrible malfunction and rumors of Darnassian sabotage are rampant. Travel there and deal with anyone that looks suspicious. Report back to Ley-Keeper Velania
column7: who watches over the sanctum.

column1: A Job for an Intelligent Man^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Foreman Biggums^Foreman Biggums^^The Path of Anguish^^Kill 15 Marauding Crust Bursters and return to Foreman Biggums at Honor Hold.^Well met
column2: <class>. Now that reinforcements are finally arriving
column3: we can recapture some semblance of a normal life. One of our first goals is to restore the flow of men and goods along the road to the southwest
column4: but it must be reclaimed from the crust bursters that've overrun the area. If you're willing to help us deal with this menace
column5: you would have the gratitude of the Sons. Watch carefully for the disturbed ground they leave in their wake.

column1: Smooth as Butter^61^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Legassi^Legassi^Ravager Egg Roundup^^^Bring 12 Plump Buzzard Wings to Legassi at the Zeppelin Crash.^Screed likes to say his flying is as "smooth as butter." I think "butterfingered" is more like it! Take a look at the wreckage over there. He calls it a "rough" landing. Sure
column2: we got shot at
column3: but I'd be willing to cut him a little more slack if he didn't brag about his piloting skills so often! I think I'm going to make him a batch of wings to drive the point home. To the east
column4: in the Valley of Bones
column5: you'll find bonestripper buzzards. Their wings are plump
column6: juicy
column7: and perfect for my needs.

column1: Ranger Sareyn^9^Horde^Eversong Woods^Marniel Amberlight^Ranger Sareyn^^^^Report to Ranger Sareyn outside Fairbreeze Village in Eversong Woods.^Don't take the safety of this village for granted. We're under siege by the Scourge on the east and the Wretched to the west. Ranger Sareyn keeps our borders safe from the undead that pour in from the Dead Scar. Follow the road eastwards out of town and see if you can lend her a hand.

Farstrider Retreat^10^Horde^Eversong Woods^Ranger Degolien^Lieutenant Dawnrunner^Farstrider Retreat^Situation at Sunsail Anchorage^^Report to Lieutenant Dawnrunner at the Farstrider Retreat in Eversong Woods.^Your help in subduing the Wretched has been invaluable. The Farstriders would surely have use for someone like you in their fight against the Amani trolls. Look for the Farstrider Retreat to the northeast of here
column2: speak to Lieutenant Dawnrunner and see what assistance she might need.

column1: Amani Invasion^11^Horde^Eversong Woods^Amani Invasion Plans^Lieutenant Dawnrunner^Amani Invasion^^^Deliver the Amani Invasion Plans to Lieutenant Dawnrunner at Farstrider Retreat.^Though you don't understand the language in these battle plans
column2: you clearly make out a map marking the positions of the Farstrider Retreat and Fairbreeze Village. You'd best let Lieutenant Dawnrunner at the Farstrider Retreat know about this.

column1: Helboar
column2: the Other White Meat^61^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Legassi^Legassi^Ravager Egg Roundup^^^Legassi at the Zeppelin Crash wants you to gather 8 Purified Helboar Meat. To purify the meat
column3: use the Purification Mixture on the Tainted Helboar Meat you gather from Helboars.^Those eggs are superb
column4: but what do you say we kick it up another notch? A side of bacon would round out the meal perfectly and I know just where to get it. This place is littered with helboars. Of course
column5: there's no one here to inspect and tenderize the meat
column6: but we're in luck! <Legassi rummages around in his pack and produces a flask.> This wasn't made for use on pork
column7: but cooking is as much about improvisation as anything else!

column1: Warlord Krellian^60^All^Mage^Archmage Xylem^Archmage Xylem^Warlord Krellian^^^Retrieve the Prismatic Shell for Archmage Xylem. The Archmage resides in a tower atop the cliffs of Azshara.^There isn't much time
column2: <name>! My scrying spells have revealed a powerful source of magic. I cannot leave the tower
column3: and would ask you to kill the vile creature in possession of this artifact. The pathetic little cretin is known as Warlord Krellian
column4: hiding behind his guards in the Temple of Zin-Malor. Burn him to ashes and take the prismatic shell he covets so dearly.

column1: Warning Fairbreeze Village^11^Horde^Eversong Woods^Lieutenant Dawnrunner^Ranger Degolien^Amani Invasion^^^Travel to Fairbreeze Village in Eversong Woods and speak to Ranger Degolien.^Go to Fairbreeze Village and notify Ranger Degolien of the Amani plans. Even with Zul'Marosh dead
column2: Fairbreeze must prepare for a troll attack. Tell Degolien I will send him reinforcements as soon as possible.

column1: Fragmented Magic^60^All^Mage^Archmage Xylem^Archmage Xylem^Warlord Krellian^^^Polymorph the Spitelash of Azshara and kill the clones that appear several seconds later. When you have slain 50 Polymorph Clones
column2: return to Archmage Xylem in Azshara.^My research has revealed a unique purpose for the prismatic shell. Carry the shell and cast your polymorph spell on the Spitelash in Azshara. If you wait a few moments
column3: the chaotic aura of the shell will cause them to split into several smaller clones for a few moments. Kill these clones as quickly as possible
column4: and the shell will collect their essence. When the shell is full
column5: return it to me.

column1: In Need of Felblood^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Ryathen the Somber^Ryathen the Somber^In Need of Felblood^^^Ryathen the Somber at Falcon Watch in Hellfire Peninsula wants you to bring him 6 Felblood Samples from the Terrorfiends that inhabit the Pools of Aggonar.^Northeast of here lie the Pools of Aggonar. Once a sacred site to the draenei
column2: their waters were corrupted after the blood from the demon Aggonar was spilled into them. That blood
column3: though old and diluted
column4: still possesses tremendous power. Terrorfiends now walk the area
column5: empowered by the pure demonic energies of the original blood. Slay them and retrieve as much felblood as you can. I'll make it worth your while.

column1: Replenishing the Healing Crystals^1^Human
column2: Dwarf
column3: ^Azuremyst Isle^Proenitus^Proenitus^Replenishing the Healing Crystals^^Urgent Delivery!^Acquire 8 Vials of Moth Blood from the nearby Vale Moths and bring them to Proenitus at the Crash Site in Ammen Vale.^We are the draenei. Our ship crashed and
column4: since we have many wounded
column5: our immediate concern is the depleted state of our healing crystals. We must replenish them quickly! Unfortunately
column6: the only way to do this at this point is to extract the blood from the local vale moths. Their blood will make for a suitable substitute. The moths can be found in many places around the vale
column7: but mostly in the northwest.

column1: The Cleansing Must Be Stopped^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Ryathen the Somber^Ryathen the Somber^In Need of Felblood^^^Place the Signaling Gem near the Altar of Aggonar at the Pools of Aggonar and defeat any Draenei Anchorites that respond to your summons. Return to Ryathen the Somber at Falcon Watch with the Signaling Gem after completing this task.^Our scouts captured a draenei paladin at the Pools of Aggonar. He was to take part in a cleansing ritual to purify the pools. We must stop the draenei from succeeding or we will lose our supply of felblood! He was carrying this signaling gem
column2: looking to mark a spot where a priest - or "anchorite" as they call themselves - could perform their rituals in safety. Place the gem near the Altar of Aggonar and be ready to ambush any approaching draenei. I suggest that you take a friend or two along.

column1: Botanist Taerix^2^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Proenitus^Botanist Taerix^Botanist Taerix^Urgent Delivery!^^Speak with Botanist Taerix at the Crash Site in Ammen Vale.^<name>
column2: Botanist Taerix is in need of your assistance. You'll find her with her apprentices to the west
column3: outside the ship.

column1: Demonic Contamination^63^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Thiah Redmane^Thiah Redmane^Helping the Cenarion Post^^^Thiah Redmane
column2: at the Cenarion Post in Hellfire Peninsula
column3: has asked you to gather 6 Helboar Blood Samples from Hulking Helboars.^Welcome to the Cenarion Post
column4: <class>. We don't often get company out here
column5: but I'm grateful for the visit. My work with the creatures of this desolate land requires me to travel to many remote places. The Cenarion Expedition has dispatched me to study some of the most dangerous wildlife in Outland
column6: and I've made a startling discovery. While many creatures here have already undergone radical changes
column7: they continue to mutate. I'm collecting blood samples to document the changes
column8: and any help would be welcome.

column1: Missing Missive^61^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Eroded Leather Case^Thiah Redmane^^^^Return the Eroded Leather Case to Thiah Redmane
column2: camped near the Ruins of Sha'naar in western Hellfire Peninsula.^Upon examining the battered leather case
column3: it becomes apparent that the container's damage must've been caused by the caustic fluid of the worm's digestive tract. The leather appears to have been intricately tooled at one time
column4: but the details of its adornment can no longer be made out. The only recognizable feature of the case is a worn logo of the Cenarion Circle. Knowing nothing about the contents of the case
column5: you decide the best course of action would be to deliver it to a Circle member.

column1: Arelion's Journal^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Magistrix Carinda^Magistrix Carinda^Arelion's Journal^^^Magistrix Carinda at Falcon Watch in Hellfire Peninsula wants you to go to the Pools of Aggonar and retrieve Arelion's Journal.^My husband
column2: Arelion
column3: had been fascinated with the Pools of Aggonar ever since we arrived in Outland. He spent much of his time studying slimes
column4: of all things! He went missing in there a few days ago. They say he's dead and there's nothing I can do about it. One thing I can do is try to ensure that his research doesn't die with him. Go northeast to the pools and look for his journal. He always carried it inside a brown knapsack.

column1: The Road to Falcon Watch^63^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Wounded Blood Elf Pilgrim^Taleris Dawngazer^The Road to Falcon Watch^^^Protect the Wounded Blood Elf Pilgrim on her way to Falcon Watch
column2: then speak with Taleris Dawngazer.^<The battered blood elf's face displays relief at your presence.> Please
column3: <class>
column4: get me out of this cage! I foolishly set out from Thrallmar ahead of the main group
column5: despite Martik Tor'seldori's warnings. I was set upon by horrible creatures that could only be the ravagers he talked about. I managed to drive them off
column6: but that was only the beginning of my troubles. As I bound my wounds
column7: those bird men found me
column8: dragged me back to this cave
column9: and locked me in this cage! I must get to Falcon Watch!

column1: A Pilgrim's Plight^63^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Taleris Dawngazer^Taleris Dawngazer^The Road to Falcon Watch^^^The Wounded Blood Elf Pilgrim was attacked by Quillfang Ravagers while camped in Dustquill Ravine. Find her camp and search it for the missing pack.^That wounded pilgrim seems to be shouting something about a pack. When you encountered her
column2: did you see a pack nearby? Hmm... She must've left it when fleeing from her attackers. The quillfang ravagers
column3: in their ravine to the south
column4: are known to attack solitary travelers. If she doesn't calm down
column5: I won't be able to tend her wounds. Her stubbornness may just cost her her life. Go to Dustquill Ravine and see if you can find her campsite. I'm willing to bet she left it there.

column1: Trueflight Arrows^63^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Falconer Drenna Riverwind^Falconer Drenna Riverwind^^^^Gather 8 Bonestripper Tail Feathers from Bonestripper Vultures and bring them to Falconer Drenna Riverwind at Falcon Watch.^With the influx of pilgrims and the encroachment of Alliance forces
column2: things around Falcon Watch have gotten quite busy lately. In my spare time
column3: I usually help prepare batches of arrows for the rangers
column4: but I haven't had the chance to gather feathers for the fletching in a long time. I could offer you a bit of coin if you'd be willing to gather the tail feathers of the bonestripper vultures. In the past
column5: I've found them circling the bones of large beasts to the north of Falcon Watch.

column1: An Ambitious Plan^63^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Elsaana^Elsaana^^^^Use the Sanctified Crystal against a wounded Uncontrolled Voidwalker and return to Elsaana at the Temple of Telhamat.^The blood elves epitomize the irresponsible use of magic
column2: <class>. They do not control magical energy. Rather
column3: they are slaves to it and will suffer nothing to stand between them and their addiction. They consume the energies of Outland's voidwalkers to power their demonic magics. I've prepared a crystal charged with a spell that will allow us to neutralize a voidwalker and sever its link to this world when destroyed. I've mostly seen the voidwalkers in the Warp Fields to the southeast of Hellfire Citadel.

column1: Rampaging Ravagers^63^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Gremni Longbeard^Gremni Longbeard^^^^Kill 10 Quillfang Ravagers and return to Gremni Longbeard in Hellfire Peninsula.^So Honor Hold sends us to deal with the arakkoa and we set up camp here thinking hey isn't this a great spot. Little did we know how close we were to the quillfang ravagers. They are relentless predators and have made any sort of work on our part impossible. There's a bit of coin in it for you if you can deal with them for us. Do you feel up to it?

Source of the Corruption^63^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Apothecary Azethen^Apothecary Azethen^^^^Travel to the Ruins of Sha'naar in Hellfire Peninsula and obtain 5 Demonic Essences from the Illidari Taskmasters. Return to Apothecary Azethen at Falcon Watch after you've completed the task.^Uncorrupted draenei
column2: like this unlucky fellow here
column3: are virtuous champions of the Light. What corruption caused their great race to devolve into the Broken and Lost Ones? I've heard a theory that exposure to fel energies is what caused the mutation. I would like to put that theory to the test. Northwest of here lie the Ruins of Sha'naar. There you will find lowly Broken commanded by Illidari taskmasters. Bring me demonic essences from the taskmasters so that I can test them on this draenei.

column1: In Search of Sedai^62^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Anchorite Obadei^Sedai's Corpse^In Search of Sedai^^^Anchorite Obadei wants you to look for his brother
column2: Sedai
column3: nearby to the east in Hellfire Peninsula.^Hear my plight
column4: <class>. My brother
column5: Sedai
column6: left long ago to contact the orcs of Mag'har Post. Ever the idealist
column7: he thought the time was ripe to set our differences aside and negotiate a peace with them. He's been missing for days and I fear for the worst. Would you set my mind to rest and look for him? Sedai must be somewhere nearby to the east.

column1: Marking the Path^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Ranger Captain Venn'ren^Ranger Captain Venn'ren^Falcon Watch^^^Ranger Captain Venn'ren at Falcon Watch wants you to go to the Great Fissure in Hellfire Peninsula and light the Southern Beacon
column2: Western Beacon and Central Beacon. Return to him with the Lit Torch after you've completed this task.^With the rock flayer population thinned
column3: all that's left is to signal the safe path to our pilgrims. Return to the Great Fissure with this torch and seek the three beacons that mark the path from the east. Light the three beacons and return to me. Be warned that the beacons will attract any nearby rock flayers when you first light them.

column1: Rogue Training^1^Blood Elf^Rogue^Magistrix Erona^Pathstalker Kariel^^Reclaiming Sunstrider Isle^Well Watcher Solanian^Speak with Pathstalker Kariel - the Rogue class trainer - inside the Sunspire on Sunstrider Isle.^As you advance within your class
column2: you will want to take advantage of the training that your class trainer can provide you. For young rogues here on Sunstrider Isle
column3: your trainer is Pathstalker Kariel. Speak with Kariel and see what training he has available for you. The things he will teach do have a cost
column4: so bring some coin with you. Kariel - as with all the trainers on Sunstrider Isle - is inside the Sunspire on the lower level.

column1: Hunter Training^1^Blood Elf^Hunter^Magistrix Erona^Ranger Sallina^^Reclaiming Sunstrider Isle^Well Watcher Solanian^Speak with Ranger Sallina - the Hunter class trainer - inside the Sunspire on Sunstrider Isle.^As you advance within your class
column2: you will want to take advantage of the training that your class trainer can provide you. For young hunters here on Sunstrider Isle
column3: your trainer is Ranger Sallina. Speak with Sallina and see what training she has available for you. The things she will teach do have a cost
column4: so bring some coin with you. Sallina - as with all the trainers on Sunstrider Isle - is inside the Sunspire on the lower level.

column1: Where's Wyllithen?^10^Horde^Eversong Woods^Apprentice Loralthalis^Groundskeeper Wyllithen^Where's Wyllithen?^^^Find Groundskeeper Wyllithen on the Duskwither Grounds in Eversong Woods.^The Duskwither groundskeeper has gone missing! Someone must have forgotten to tell him to leave when the magister and everyone else did. I know that he's still somewhere around here on the grounds
column2: but I dare not go looking for him myself with all of these magical creatures roaming about. Will you find him for me
column3: <class>
column4: and make sure that he's alright?

column1: Saltheril's Haven^9^Horde^Eversong Woods^Magistrix Landra Dawnstrider^Lord Saltheril^Saltheril's Haven^Research Notes^^Speak with Lord Saltheril at Saltheril's Haven in Eversong Woods.^I swear that I'm going to fireball someone if I get one more request from Lord Saltheril concerning supplies for his party! Do I look like a party planner?! Between you and me
column2: that fool and his sycophants are living in denial that we're under attack here! Some of us are actually busy with
column3: oh
column4: I don't know
column5: defending what's left of Quel'Thalas! <class>
column6: would you please head over to Saltheril's Haven and see if you can shut him up? It's just down the road to the west.

column1: Magic of the Arakkoa^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Arcanist Calesthris Dawnstar^Arcanist Calesthris Dawnstar^^^^Bring 4 Haal'eshi Scrolls to Arcanist Calesthris Dawnstar at Falcon Watch in Hellfire Peninsula.^Outland holds many secrets
column2: <name>. It's only a matter of time before we uncover them all. The half-bird
column3: half-man species of the arakkoa possesses ancient arcane knowledge that would aid us greatly in our exploration of this world. Travel to the Den of Haal'esh
column4: south of here. Obtain any magical scrolls that the Haal'eshi might be carrying on them and bring them to me.

column1: Birds of a Feather^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Falconer Drenna Riverwind^Falconer Drenna Riverwind^^^^Travel to the Den of Haal'esh in Hellfire Peninsula and search the Kaliri Nests for a Female Kaliri Hatchling. Use the Empty Birdcage to capture it and bring it to Falconer Drenna Riverwind at Falcon Watch.^The Haal'eshi arakkoa have domesticated a beautiful bird species called the kaliri. I've managed to capture a young male and they appear to be trainable. The females are much rarer
column2: but if I had one I could attempt to breed them. She has to be young
column3: though... a hatchling. An older wild bird wouldn't survive in captivity. Take this cage and travel south
column4: to the Den of Haal'esh. Search the nests for eggs that are ready to hatch. If you bring me back a female hatchling
column5: I'll reward you handsomely.

column1: Deadly Predators^62^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Scout Vanura^Scout Vanura^^^^Scout Vanura at the Temple of Telhamat in Hellfire Peninsula wants you to slay 8 Stonescythe Whelps and 4 Stonescythe Alpha.^The Broken that live in Outland have endured endless violence. It is of little surprise that as soon as the Dark Portal opened they flocked to it in droves with hopes of escaping this land. Unfortunately for our confused brothers and sisters coming from the south
column2: the rock flayers that inhabit the Great Fissure see them as easy prey. Go there and thin the rock flayer population
column3: so that our kin might have a chance.

column1: Cruel Taskmasters^63^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Ikan^Ikan^^^^Slay 4 Illidari Taskmasters at the Ruins of Sha'naar and return to Ikan at the Temple of Telhamat in Hellfire Peninsula.^You probably think most Broken are evil
column2: don't you? In reality many just lack guidance. Before I met the Omenai
column3: I too was lost. Our minds suffered terrible pain from the orcs' demonic magic. We are easily confused and taken advantage of. Demons allied with Illidan raid Hellfire daily and capture our kind as slaves. With the Omenai we now have hope. Travel to the Ruins of Sha'naar
column4: southwest of here
column5: and slay the Illidari taskmasters so my people may be free!

column1: The Assassin^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Nazgrel^Fel Orc Corpse^The Assassin^Return to Thrallmar^^Nazgrel wants you to travel to the road north of Hellfire Citadel and look for an assassin named Krun Spinebreaker.^<name>
column2: we recently uncovered a plot to assassinate our envoy to Falcon Watch. Hellfire Citadel learned of our plans to send an expedition there earlier this morning and set up an ambush. Our scouts have informed me that an assassin known as Krun Spinebreaker waits along the road north of the Citadel. Go there and slay this assassin. Show the fel orcs we're not to be trifled with!

column1: A Strange Weapon^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Fel Orc Corpse^Nazgrel^The Assassin^^^Bring the Heavy Stone Axe to Nazgrel in Thrallmar in Hellfire Peninsula.^You pull the stone axe out of the body to examine it more closely. There's something unusual about the craftsmanship of the weapon. Its origin appears orcish
column2: though the materials aren't like anything you've seen before. Nazgrel might be interested in seeing the weapon.

column1: Fetch!^10^Horde^Mage^Instructor Antheol^Instructor Antheol^Fetch!^^The Balnir Farmstead^Dive to the bottom of Stillwhisper Pond and retrieve the Azure Phial for Instructor Antheol.^So... <name> is it? Don't be flattered I know your name
column2: one of my students has been fawning over you and won't shut up. Hmm... if you'd like to impress <her/him>
column3: why don't you do something for me? There's an azure phial at the bottom of the pond behind me. Dive in
column4: retrieve it
column5: and bring it here.

column1: The Purest Water^10^Horde^Mage^Instructor Antheol^Instructor Antheol^Fetch!^^^Instructor Antheol wants you to fill the Azure Phial at Elrendar Falls.^Now that you've learned a little lesson
column2: I'll offer you something more substantial. It concerns your ability to defend yourself in close combat. Of course
column3: you should only resort to melee in the most dire of circumstances
column4: but that is no excuse to be unprepared. I can assist you in creating a staff befitting a mage of your learning. Simply take the phial you retrieved for me and fill it at the base of Elrendar Falls. Just follow the river southeast from here.

column1: Recently Living^10^Horde^Mage^Instructor Antheol^Instructor Antheol^Fetch!^^^Slay the Eversong Green Keepers until they yield a Living Branch for Instructor Antheol.^You may have noticed the walking trees near Elrendar Falls. As the keepers of nature
column2: they are infused with a primal magic we can reform to our own purposes using the pure water you have already brought to me. Unfortunately
column3: the green keepers are gnarled and twisted creatures
column4: so you may need to kill a few before you find a useable branch.

column1: The Warchief's Mandate^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Nazgrel^Far Seer Regulkut^The Assassin^^^Bring the Heavy Stone Axe to Far Seer Regulkut at Thrallmar in Hellfire Peninsula.^As you know
column2: the warchief put his power behind this expedition for one reason. This is the world we came from. This is where our roots lie. This journey means different things to orcs and blood elves. To them it's a search for the promised land. To us it's more like returning home. Whoever made this axe is familiar with the old ways and we must contact them. This is too important for us to use ordinary tracking methods. Show the weapon to Far Seer Regulkut; she will know what to do.

column1: The Mag'har^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Gorkan Bloodfist^Nazgrel^The Assassin^^^Deliver the Letter from the Mag'har to Nazgrel at Thrallmar in Hellfire Peninsula.^This news you bring from beyond the Dark Portal... you want us to believe the son of Durotan now rules over the lands beyond it... free from any demonic taint? And that now his people have returned to this world? I hope for your sake that this isn't some manner of joke
column2: <class>. What this means to my people... cannot be described. I must send word to Nagrand at once! Hellscream must hear about this. Take this letter back to your leader in Thrallmar. Tell him the Mag'har welcome them!

column1: Through the Dark Portal^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Warlord Dar'toon^Lieutenant General Orion^Through the Dark Portal^^^Travel through the Dark Portal and find Lieutenant General Orion. He awaits your arrival on the other side
column2: in Outland.^For years the Dark Portal loomed silent... forgotten. But it is silent no longer. After stopping the demonic assault here
column3: our forces breached the portal and met the demons on their own ground! Now
column4: we are locked in a savage war
column5: and there are some who think we might not win. So it is our duty
column6: our grim pleasure
column7: to battle the fiends of Outland and ensure our victory
column8: <name>. If you would help us
column9: then report to Lieutenant General Orion at once. He awaits you in the Outland...

column1: Urgent Delivery!^2^All^Azuremyst Isle^Proenitus^Zalduun^You Survived!^^Rescue the Survivors!
column2: Botanist Taerix^Deliver the Bundle of Vials to Zalduun at the Crash Site in Ammen Vale.^Now that you've gathered all that we need to replenish our healing crystals
column3: I need you to deliver the vials to Zalduun
column4: our priest. You'll find him tending to our wounded inside the central chamber of the ship.

column1: A Spirit Guide^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Far Seer Regulkut^Gorkan Bloodfist^The Assassin^^^Use the Wolf Totem at the location where you found Krun Spinebreaker's body and follow the Ancestral Spirit Wolf.^Even our best tracking wolves' senses can fail them
column2: <name>. The spirits have a way of seeing the world differently than ours. The being you will call forth will find the person you seek
column3: for they'll be drawn not to their scent but their essence. Go now
column4: <class>
column5: take this totem with you and use it at the location you found the stone axe.

column1: Report to Marshal Bluewall^60^Alliance^Silithus^Rifleman Torrig^Marshal Bluewall^Report to Marshal Bluewall^^^Speak with Marshal Bluewall at the Alliance encampment near Hive'Zora.^Are you Marshal Bluewall's new recruits? Of course you are. What are you waiting for? Good soldiers are dying in the desert. Aren't you excited to join them? Now
column2: get going and don't dry out on the way.

column1: Report to General Kirika^60^Horde^Silithus^Scout Bloodfist^General Kirika^Report to General Kirika^^^Speak with General Kirika at the Horde encampment near Hive'Regal.^You must be one of General Kirika's new recruits. It's about time you showed up. Bodies wear down quick in the desert. The dwarves have been getting reinforcements daily
column2: and we can't afford to lose ground in our struggle for resources in Silithus. Get your instructions from the General. It's not my job to train you
column3: just find you.

column1: The Arakkoa Threat^63^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Gremni Longbeard^Gremni Longbeard^The Longbeards^^^Gremni Longbeard in Hellfire Peninsula wants you to slay 4 Haal'eshi Windwalkers and 6 Haal'eshi Talonguards.^The arakkoa are smart creatures... smart as any gnome you ever met. They have this way with magic and a violent temper
column2: however. Lately they've taken to attacking Honor Hold patrols
column3: which is why we were sent here. See
column4: Mirren and I are world-famous marksmen
column5: we are! But fowl and game are what we specialize in... not these... lightning-invoking birdmen. So what do you say you give us a hand in this one assignment? You'll find the Den of Haal'esh to the southwest.

column1: Avruu's Orb^63^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Avruu's Orb^Aeranas^^^^Take Avruu's Orb to the Haal'eshi Altar southeast of the Den of Haal'esh in Hellfire Peninsula and give it to Aeranas once he's free.^<As you hold the orb closer to you
column2: you hear a voice address you.> I sense you're not of the arakkoa
column3: so I will attempt to barter for my freedom. My name is Aeranas. I once ruled over the eastern winds. The Haal'eshi mage
column4: Avruu
column5: trapped me inside this orb. Find the altar the arakkoa used to enslave me. It is hidden to the southeast of the arakkoa's den. Approach it with the orb and give it to me once I'm free. In exchange for my liberty I'll reward you with powerful treasure!

column1: Scouring the Desert^60^Alliance^Silithus^Marshal Bluewall^Marshal Bluewall^Report to Marshal Bluewall^^^Find and deliver Silithyst to the Silithyst Extractor
column2: then speak with Marshal Bluewall at the Alliance encampment near Hive'Zora.^We recently found out that the Horde has been scavenging the Silithus desert for resources
column3: but paid them little mind. We thought it could not be worth it to station large numbers in this sweltering desert. However
column4: it was discovered the importance of the resources
column5: and now we are scrambling to catch up. If I have your assistance
column6: you must go into the desert and recover the silithyst and return it here.

column1: The Finest Down^62^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Mirren Longbeard^Mirren Longbeard^Gaining Mirren's Trust^^^Mirren Longbeard in Hellfire Peninsula wants you to bring him 8 Kaliri Feathers from the various kaliri found in the Den of Haal'esh.^The arakkoa at the Den of Haal'esh
column2: south of here
column3: breed a magnificent species of birds called kaliri. Their feathers would fetch a bundle at the trading posts back in Azeroth. Just think of all the ale I could buy then! Tell you what
column4: you bring me a stack of kaliri feathers and I'll give you my very own hat. What do you say? You'll never find a hat like this one! Do we have a deal?

column1: Scouring the Desert^60^All^Silithus^General Kirika^General Kirika^Report to General Kirika^^^Find and deliver Silithyst to the Silithyst Extractor then speak with General Kirika at the Horde encampment near Hive'Regal.^For some time now
column2: we have been tapping the crystal resources of the Silithus desert. The only dangers we faced were from the creatures that made this place their home and the oppressive sand and dust and heat. But now the Alliance seems to have caught on to what we have found here. It is now a race between us to capture the natural resources
column3: and keep them from the other. I need every set of hands that is available. I hope I have yours.

column1: Return to Obadei^62^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Sedai's Corpse^Anchorite Obadei^In Search of Sedai^^Makuru's Vengeance^Return to Anchorite Obadei at the Temple of Telhamat in Hellfire Peninsula and inform him of Sedai's death.^With Sedai's death confirmed
column2: you're left with the unpleasant task of returning to Obadei with the grim news.

column1: Makuru's Vengeance^63^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Makuru^Makuru^^Return to Obadei^Atonement^Makuru at the Temple of Telhamat in Hellfire Peninsula wants you to bring him 10 Mag'har Ancestral Beads.^Sedai was like a brother to Makuru. We owe him our lives and more! They call Makuru crazy but if the Omenai are not going to do anything about his death then they're the crazy ones! Makuru doesn't have much to call his own in this world
column2: but he will give you his only possession if you avenge Sedai. I've seen the brown orc Mag'har grunts before
column3: up in the hills to the northeast. They hate us! They don't deserve our mercy! Go
column4: avenge Sedai! Bring me their ancestral beads as proof!

column1: Report to Tarren Mill^20^Blood Elf^Hillsbrad Foothills^Ambassador Sunsorrow^Advisor Duskingdawn^^^^Travel to Tarren Mill in the Hillsbrad Foothills and speak with Advisor Duskingdawn.^Ah
column2: good to see you here
column3: <class>! I've a task that you are perfectly suited to. As new members of the Horde
column4: we need to make sure that we support their efforts and help them with their problems. That way they'll be more receptive to helping us with ours. Travel to the Forsaken town
column5: Tarren Mill
column6: in the Hillsbrad Foothills to the southeast. Check in with Advisor Duskingdawn when you arrive.

column1: The Pools of Aggonar^62^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Amaan the Wise^Amaan the Wise^The Pools of Aggonar^^^Amaan the Wise wants you to go to the Pools of Aggonar and slay 6 Terrorfiends and 6 Blistering Rots.^Much has changed since the days when we called this land Draenor. Parts of the land have been forever changed by the demons' taint. One such place is known as the Pools of Aggonar. It was once the location of our people's sacred springs. The blood of the demon Aggonar fouled the very essence of the holy waters. This fel blood has spawned foul beings that must be cleansed if we're ever to reclaim the pools. Travel east of here and slay the Terrorfiends and slimes that wander the pools.

Cleansing the Waters^62^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Amaan the Wise^Amaan the Wise^The Pools of Aggonar^^^Amaan the Wise wants you to travel to the Pools of Aggonar and use the Cleansing Vial at Aggonar's corpse. Return to him when Aggonar's essence is cleansed from the water.^I must ask that you finish what we've set in motion. Now that the demonic influence has weakened you must take this cleansing vial and pour it at the very source of the taint - Aggonar's own corpse. You will find the demon's bones at the northern end of the pools. Beware
column2: I sense that Aggonar's essence has not quite left this world.

column1: Report to Splintertree Post^20^Blood Elf^Ashenvale^Ambassador Dawnsinger^Advisor Sunsworn^^^^Travel to Splintertree Post in Ashenvale and speak with Advisor Sunsworn.^<The ambassador keeps her voice low as she leans in close.> Your reputation precedes you
column2: <name>. I want you to travel to Splintertree Post in Ashenvale. The easiest way to get there on foot is to travel west through Durotar and the Barrens
column3: and then turn north at the fork in the road. When you arrive
column4: speak with Advisor Sunsworn. Travel carefully; Ashenvale can be a very dangerous place!

column1: Travel to Darkshire^20^Draenei^Duskwood^Emissary Taluun^Anchorite Delan^^^^Travel to Darkshire in Duskwood and speak with Anchorite Delan.^I am told that there is a thorn in the side of the kingdom of Stormwind. It is known as Duskwood
column2: and it is a place that is filled with evil and the vile stench of undeath. As we're trying to help as much as we can
column3: I would like for you to travel southeast to the main human settlement there
column4: named Darkshire. Anchorite Delan will be awaiting your arrival.

column1: Sha'naar Relics^63^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Amaan the Wise^Amaan the Wise^Atonement^^^Amaan the Wise at the Temple of Telhamat in Hellfire Peninsula wants you to travel to the Ruins of Sha'naar and retrieve 10 Sha'naar Relics.^As I've told you before
column2: I do not require eyes to see what others cannot. I will not pass judgment on what you did on Makuru's behalf
column3: yet I think you need to see beyond what your eyes show you. Travel southwest to the Ruins of Sha'naar and salvage any relics you find. If fate wills it you will find what we need. The meaning of my request might not be immediately apparent. Have faith though
column4: <name>. Clarity comes to those with patience.

column1: A Different Approach^28^Horde^Thousand Needles^Magistrix Elosai^Wizlo Bearingshiner^A Different Approach^^^Gather 2 handfuls of Purifying Earth from Thundering Boulderkin and take them to Wizlo Bearingshiner at Whitereach Post.^What's a sin'dorei doing standing on the top of a windswept butte in Thousand Needles instead of the halls of Silvermoon? It's simple. My brethren will no longer have me. Every copy of my treatise on natural cures for our magical addiction was burned. I can safely pursue my research here
column2: but I am without my reagents. If you'd be willing to gather purifying earth from the thundering boulderkin near the western end of the Needles and deliver it to my associate at Whitereach Post
column3: I'd appreciate it.

column1: Travel to Astranaar^20^Draenei^Ashenvale^Emissary Valustraa^Vindicator Palanaar^^^^Travel to Astranaar in Ashenvale and speak with Vindicator Palais.^I am glad that you are here to help. In fact
column2: there is something that you can do. As part of our inclusion within the Alliance
column3: I would like for you to travel to the night elf town
column4: Astranaar. It is located in Ashenvale
column5: a large forest that is south of Darkshore on the continent of Kalimdor. Please speak with Vindicator Palais when you arrive to see if there's anything that you can do to help the inhabitants.

column1: A Dip in the Moonwell^28^Horde^Thousand Needles^Wizlo Bearingshiner^Wizlo Bearingshiner^A Different Approach^^^Use the Robotron Control while standing near the Concealed Command Console hidden in a small cluster of bushes on the rim of the needle closest to Thalanaar to take command of a Robotron 3000. Pilot the robot to the western edge of Thousand Needles where the Alliance outpost of Thalanaar is located. Use the robot to collect a sample of the moonwell's water and return it to Wizlo Bearingshiner at Whitereach Post.^Stop looking at me like that! I didn't say I was going to send you to Thalanaar's moonwell out in the open with dipper and a flask! I've been
column2: err... tinkering with a product I was transporting for a client. In fact
column3: I've already set up a portable control console for the Robotron out near Thalanaar. You'll need to bring this control unit with you and use it in the vicinity of my concealed console. If my client ever heard that I so much as removed Robotron from its packaging
column4: he'd hang me by my ears!

column1: Testing the Tonic^28^Horde^Thousand Needles^Wizlo Bearingshiner^Magistrix Elosai^A Different Approach^^^Deliver the Crate of Reagents to Magistrix Elosai at Freewind Post.^<Wizlo retrieves the water sample from the robot and places it in a crate with the boulderkin earth and several other items.> There you go
column2: that's everything on Magistrix Elosai's list. Tell her that it's been a pleasure working with her and that I wish her luck in her research.

column1: Missing Crystals^29^Alliance^Hillsbrad Foothills^Huraan^Huraan^^^^Retrieve the Shipment of Rare Crystals from the Forsaken and return it to Huraan in Southshore.^If there's one great truth about Hillsbrad
column2: it's that this region is destined to live under the shadow of war. Even something as innocuous as a cartload of stone is a target. Normally the loss of building materials is no great setback
column3: but the most recent shipment from the Azurelode mine contained a crate of rare crystals I was eager to study. Forsaken raiders intercepted the cart and drove it northeast to a tower they're attempting to rebuild. It's imperative that we retrieve those crystals
column4: <class>!

column1: Bloodscalp Insight^34^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Nemeth Hawkeye^Nemeth Hawkeye^Bloodscalp Insight^^^Nemeth Hawkeye at Grom'gol Base Camp wants you to bring him a Bloodscalp Totem from a Bloodscalp Shaman.^Well met
column2: <class>. I've made a habit of studying the fighting techniques of the various troll tribes in my travels
column3: and I've noticed a trend. The Bloodscalp trolls at the Tkashi Ruins and Bal'lal Ruins to the north use some of the same tactics as the Amani of the northern forests. Their magic seems to have diverged in an interesting direction and they've used it to become the strongest tribe in the area. It could form the core of a powerful weapon against the Amani
column4: but first I must find out more about it.

column1: Twilight of the Dawn Runner^37^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Balandar Brightstar^Balandar Brightstar^^^^Balandar Brightstar in Brackenwall Village wants you to reclaim the Dawn Runner Cargo and rescue his first mate Ithania from forces of Theramore at North Point Tower.^The ogres here are useful for little more than crude jokes
column2: sour ale
column3: and bouts of headbutting. When my ship
column4: the Dawn Runner
column5: ran aground
column6: those curs from Theramore made off with my cargo and last surviving crewman. I made my way here searching for help
column7: but those good-for-nothing ogres stared blankly at me when I told them my story. I could use the help of a reliable <race> in recovering what remains of my cargo and freeing Ithania from North Point Tower
column8: to the northeast
column9: where they're being held.

column1: Messenger to Thrall^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Nazgrel^Thrall^The Assassin^^Envoy to the Mag'har^Travel to Orgrimmar and give Thrall the Letter from Nazgrel.^The warchief has been waiting for word of this ever since we set foot on Outland. Now you get the honor of giving him the news of the Mag'har yourself. Go quickly
column2: <name>. Take this letter with you; it bears my personal seal. There is nothing that Thrall wants to hear more than the message you bear.

column1: Unclaimed Baggage^40^Horde^Badlands^Advisor Sarophas^Advisor Sarophas^^^^Retrieve the Advisor's Pack and Advisor's Rapier from their holding places in the Angor Fortress and return them to Advisor Sarophas at Kargath.^This is Kargath? Oh
column2: dear. I expected a
column3: a... well
column4: some kind of settlement
column5: some sign of civilization here in the wilderness. There must be a mistake; surely this hovel full of uncouth
column6: unwashed
column7: sniggering savages can't be the headquarters of the Expeditionary Force. The loutish barbarians had the gall to laugh at me when I told them about how the Dark Iron dwarves robbed me and then disappeared into the Angor Fortress. I can count on you to help me recover my possessions and my dignity
column8: can't I?

column1: Little Morsels^38^Horde^Swamp of Sorrows^Cersei Dusksinger^Cersei Dusksinger^^^^Feed the Fel-Tainted Morsels to the Lost Ones' captured animals. Then return the leftovers to Cersei Dusksinger at Stonard in the Swamp of Sorrows.^I'm perfecting a weapon to use against the draenei and you're going to help me! The Lost Ones are the backward cousins of the draenei
column2: and I've been experimenting on them. I just need you to feed some fel-tainted morsels to their captured livestock. In turn
column3: when they slaughter and eat the animals
column4: they'll be cursed! That'll show that stuffy Anchorite Avuun at the Harborage! Go now
column5: hurry! You'll find the Lost Ones and their caged animals to the northeast at the Fallow Sanctuary.

column1: Envoy to the Mag'har^63^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Thrall^Gorkan Bloodfist^^Messenger to Thrall^A Debilitating Sickness^Thrall wants you to return to Gorkan Bloodfist at Mag'har Post in Hellfire Peninsula and offer him your services.^I'd leave for Outland this very minute after hearing the news you brought. Important matters require my attention in Durotar
column2: however. I will arrange for a fitting tribute to be sent to the Mag'har immediately. I will send my most trusted diplomats as well. This will all take time... I need someone to represent us there right now. I must place my trust on you
column3: <name>. Go to the Mag'har Post in Hellfire and render whatever services you can to my kin. Do not fail me
column4: <name>. Too much depends on this.

column1: A Debilitating Sickness^63^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Earthcaller Ryga^Earthcaller Ryga^A Debilitating Sickness^Envoy to the Mag'har^^Earthcaller Ryga at Mag'har Post in Hellfire Peninsula wants you to bring her 1 Drycap Mushroom from a cave inside the Great Fissure.^It is good that you've offered to aid us
column2: <name>. Our grunts have fallen sick from drinking contaminated water and I'm missing an ingredient to produce a healing salve. I'm in need of a rare mushroom called drycap. Our foremost orders are to keep our location secret and not risk being spotted while looking for it
column3: or I would go myself. The only place in Hellfire Peninsula where drycap grows is a cave at the Great Fissure
column4: south of here. Be extremely careful if you choose to seek it.

column1: The So-Called Mark of the Lightbringer^58^Horde^Western Plaguelands^Mehlar Dawnblade^Mehlar Dawnblade^The So-Called Mark of the Lightbringer^^^Obtain the Mark of the Lightbringer and return it to Mehlar Dawnblade at the Bulwark in the Western Plaguelands.^I was once a pupil of Uther Lightbringer
column2: founder of the Knights of the Silver Hand. I saw how he mishandled Prince Arthas's training. It led to the destruction of my homeland
column3: Quel'Thalas
column4: and I blame Uther and his incompetence for all of it! And now he has a tomb in his honor - how lovely. My sources tell me that the scarlet fools are keeping one of his 'holy' relics atop their guard tower near the gates of Hearthglen. Go to the Western Plaguelands and retrieve it for me.

column1: Defiling Uther's Tomb^58^Horde^Western Plaguelands^Mehlar Dawnblade^Mehlar Dawnblade^The So-Called Mark of the Lightbringer^^^Defile Uther's Tomb and return to Mehlar Dawnblade at the Bulwark in the Western Plaguelands.^There
column2: that's better. I've added a little fel magic to it. Now
column3: you must take it to his resting place in the Western Plaguelands. Use the corrupted holy symbol in the presence of Uther's statue to defile his tomb! You'll have to get close for it to work. To find the tomb go southeast of the Ruins of Andorhal. Return to me when the deed is done. Be quick about it
column4: <class>!

column1: Tomb of the Lightbringer^58^All^Western Plaguelands^Anchorite Truuen^High Priestess MacDonnell^The Mark of the Lightbringer^^^Escort Anchorite Truuen to Uther's Tomb in the Western Plaguelands. Afterward
column2: speak with High Priestess MacDonnell at Chillwind Camp in the Western Plaguelands.^Now that you've recovered the Mark of the Lightbringer
column3: all that is left is to return it to Uther's Tomb. Would you be willing to accompany me there to do this? It's not far and I would enjoy your company. Afterward you can come back here and relate the experience to High Priestess MacDonnell. What say you
column4: <name>?

column1: Administering the Salve^63^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Earthcaller Ryga^Earthcaller Ryga^A Debilitating Sickness^^^Earthcaller Ryga wants you to administer the Healing Salve to 10 Debilitated Mag'har Grunts nearby Mag'har Post in Hellfire Peninsula.^I've prepared a simple salve that should restore our grunts' strength with the herbs you brought me. Take it and administer it to any debilitated grunts you see in the vicinity. Return to me when you're done.

Mercy for the Cursed^38^All^Swamp of Sorrows^Anchorite Avuun^Anchorite Avuun^^^^Slay 3 Cursed Lost Ones and then return to Anchorite Avuun at the Harborage in the Swamp of Sorrows.^That blood elf witch
column2: Cersei Dusksinger
column3: has been cursing the Lost Ones
column4: I just know it! I don't know why or how
column5: but the results are tragic. Several of the Lost Ones have now been further corrupted - cursed with even more fel energies! <class>
column6: can you find it in you to take pity on these poor creatures? They should not have to live out the rest of their lives in such a horrible condition. You'll find these cursed Lost Ones at the Fallow Sanctuary
column7: east down the path.

column1: Call of Earth^4^Alliance^Shaman^Firmanvaar^Spirit of the Vale^Call of Earth^^^Speak with the Spirit of the Vale at the Sacred Grove in Ammen Vale.^The time has come
column2: <name>. You have grown to the point where you are ready to commune directly with the elemental spirits of this world. But be warned. I can sense that the manner of our entry into this world
column3: and its unfortunate side effects
column4: have angered the earth spirits and caused an imbalance of the elements. If you are to create your earth totem
column5: you must first speak with the Spirit of the Vale. You will find it in the Sacred Grove
column6: nestled in the hills to the northwest.

column1: Call of Earth^4^Alliance^Shaman^Spirit of the Vale^Spirit of the Vale^Call of Earth^^^Slay 4 Restless Elements of Earth and then return to the Spirit of the Vale at the Sacred Grove in Ammen Vale.^The balance of the elements has been disrupted by the violent intrusion of the draenei to the Vale. Your crash has caused the spirits of earth to be enraged and turn upon the other elements who have come to quell them. You will learn that an understanding of the elements can only come when all are in harmony. Thus
column2: it falls to you to seek a balance. Behind me in the grove you will find the restless spirits of earth warring upon the other three elements. Help restore the balance.

column1: Call of Earth^4^Alliance^Shaman^Spirit of the Vale^Firmanvaar^Call of Earth^^^Deliver the Earth Crystal to Firmanvaar at the Crash Site in Ammen Vale.^I will now give you a piece of my physical being that you may create your earth totem. Return it to he who sent you here. You and I will be bound together for all time. Throughout your life the forces of earth will be at your disposal. The balance will come when your bones return to us at the end of your days. Use our power wisely.

Red Snapper - Very Tasty!^6^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Diktynna^Diktynna^Red Snapper - Very Tasty!^^^Use the Draenei Fishing Net to catch 10 Red Snappers. Return both the fish and the net to Diktynna on Azuremyst Isle when the task is complete.^I've found that these waters are bustling with red snapper
column2: a very tasty fish. With a fishing net
column3: I can catch enough to feed dozens of draenei! Unfortunately
column4: I was recently attacked by a creature known as a murloc while netting in the river and have suffered some injuries that prevent me from doing my job. I need help! Use this fishing net near schools of red snapper
column5: found in the Crystalbrook river to the east to catch the fish. What do you say? Remember to return the net when you are finished.

column1: Find Acteon!^6^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Diktynna^Acteon^Red Snapper - Very Tasty!^^^Deliver the Crate of Red Snapper to Acteon at Azure Watch.^You did a wonderful job
column2: <name>. Our people will be thankful for this bounty. With that said
column3: would you mind taking this haul of red snapper to Acteon at Azure Watch? He shouldn't be hard to find as he is awaiting this catch.

column1: The Great Moongraze Hunt^6^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Acteon^Acteon^The Great Moongraze Hunt^^^Bring 6 Moongraze Stag Tenderloins to Acteon at Azure Watch.^You're starting to make a name for yourself
column2: <name>. How about trying your hand at hunting? Back on Draenor
column3: our greatest hunters would hunt a beast that resembled the moongraze stag of this region known as a talbuk. If you think yourself draenei enough
column4: go out into the wilds and kill enough stags to fill your pack with meat. You will find them grazing south of Azure Watch. Watch out for their horns!

column1: Strange Findings^7^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Faintly Glowing Crystal^Exarch Menelaous^Strange Findings^^^Deliver the Faintly Glowing Crystal to Exarch Menelaous at Azure Watch.^The crystal you found on the nightstalker runt's body appears to be a piece of the Exodar. This may help explain the unusual appearance and demeanor of some of the animals in this region. Take the crystal back to Azure Watch. The exarch will surely want to know about this discovery.
Nightstalker Clean Up
column2: Isle 2...^8^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Exarch Menelaous^Exarch Menelaous^Strange Findings^^^Exarch Menelaous at Azure Watch has asked that you slay 8 Infected Nightstalker Runts.^I'm not going to make any excuses for what you've found. This is clearly our fault. We had gotten reports of crushed crystal fragments showing up in the river to the east but chose to ignore the implications. Now we can either sit around on this island and cry about the tragedy that has befallen this land or we can do something about it and prevent it from spreading. If you've got the stomach for it
column3: I want you to go back into the wilds and kill as many of the infected nightstalkers as you can find.

column1: An Unusual Patron^36^Horde^Stranglethorn Vale^Nemeth Hawkeye^Nemeth Hawkeye^Bloodscalp Insight^^^Use the Gift of Naias near the Altar of Naias to summon the water elemental Naias. Defeat him and return to Nemeth Hawkeye at Grom'gol Base Camp with the Heart of Naias.^So this Naias is the mastermind behind the Bloodscalp and their exotic magic? I'll admit
column2: this is the last place I expected my inquiry to lead
column3: but no matter
column4: our findings may still prove useful. Off the coast to the northwest is an island inhabited by lesser water elementals. There's a crude stone slab there that might serve as an altar for the likes of the trolls. Take the totem you found to that altar. Let's see if we can draw this Naias out and distill his power into a more agreeable form.

column1: Combining Forces^12^Horde^Rogue^Keltus Darkleaf^Keltus Darkleaf^Find Keltus Darkleaf^^^Keltus Darkleaf wants you to pickpocket the Lacy Handkerchief from the Sentinel Leader and bring it to him.^Keltus Darkleaf reporting for duty! Oh... who are you
column2: anyhow? If you are here for my report
column3: I insist you help me first. I am planning to attack the sentinel spies
column4: but I intend to send in my faithful Whisper as a first strike. She just needs a scent to hone in on them. Surely someone of your skill could sneak in and steal something from the sentinel leader?

column1: Call of Fire^10^All^Shaman^Tuluun^Prophet Velen^Call of Fire^^^Seek out Prophet Velen at the Vault of Lights in the Exodar.^You should know that The Prophet has been asking for you
column2: having heard of your success in your trial. The creation of your fire totem will have to wait until you have spoken with him. This is a rare honor; you must hurry to the Exodar to see him at once!

column1: Call of Fire^10^Alliance^Shaman^Sulaa^Tuluun^Call of Fire^^^Speak with Tuluun at Azure Watch on Azuremyst Isle.^<name>! It is time for you to receive further training in the ways of the spirits. You should seek out Tuluun
column2: the shaman at Azure Watch. He can begin your introduction to understanding and harnessing the power of flame.

column1: Medicinal Purpose^6^Draenei^Azuremyst Isle^Anchorite Fateema^Anchorite Fateema^^^An Alternative Alternative^Anchorite Fateema at Azure Watch wants you to bring her 8 Root Trapper Vines.^I have found that lashers milling about on the island hold restorative medicinal properties in their vines. Through proper treatment
column2: the vines can be broken down into a powerful healing ointment. Unfortunately
column3: with so many injured draenei passing through Azure Watch
column4: we are always in short supply. Our delicate guest was found injured and unconscious by the Crystalbrook only yesterday. If you bring me vines
column5: we may be able to save her. You will find root trappers both south and east of Azure Watch.

column1: Call of Fire^10^Alliance^Shaman^Tuluun^Temper^Call of Fire^^^Speak with Temper at Emberglade on Azuremyst Isle.^Once again you are to be tested
column2: and this time the chaotic element of fire must be understood if you're to create a totem to harness its energies. To the northeast on the coast is a sacred place of fire known as Emberglade. Amidst its burned trees stands Temper
column3: a fire elemental of great power
column4: and the one that you must speak with. Go to him now and may the elemental spirits of Azeroth go with you.

column1: Call of Fire^10^Alliance^Shaman^Temper^Temper^Call of Fire^^^Retrieve the Ritual Torch and return it to Temper at Emberglade on Azuremyst Isle.^One of my brethren
column2: Hauteur
column3: has gone insane
column4: no doubt because of the crash of your ship. He's begun demanding that the local owlbeasts worship him. This will not continue! None of us would ever impersonate a god! It falls to you to restore the balance. First
column5: you must retrieve their ritual torch
column6: which has been taken by the crazed wildkin inside Stillpine Hold to the west. Return the torch to me.

column1: Wanted: Blacktalon the Savage^63^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Wanted Poster^Ranger Captain Venn'ren^^^^Bring Blacktalon's Claws to Ranger Captain Venn'ren at Falcon Watch in Hellfire Peninsula.^By order of the Ranger Captain
column2: a reward is hereby offered for the slaying of the vicious rockflayer matriarch known as Blacktalon the Savage. Blacktalon was last sighted inside a cave in the Great Fissure. Individuals seeking the reward are to present the creature's claws as proof of the deed.

column1: Call of Fire^10^Alliance^Shaman^Temper^Temper^Call of Fire^^Call of Fire^Retrieve Hauteur's Ashes and then return them and the Ritual Torch to Temper at Emberglade on Azuremyst Isle. Remember that you can use the Orb of Returning to teleport back to Temper once you have the ashes.^The owlbeasts of Moonwing Den on Silvermyst Isle
column2: far to the southwest
column3: have been deluded into thinking that Hauteur is a god to be worshipped. What he truly is
column4: is a fallen elemental who needs to be put out of his misery. That torch is the key to his downfall. Hauteur regularly demands that these owlbeasts burn an effigy in his honor. So
column5: when you light it
column6: he will come. Slay him and bring me the ashes. Then use the orb in the satchel that I will give you to return to me here.

column1: Call of Fire^10^Alliance^Shaman^Temper^Tuluun^Call of Fire^Call of Fire^^Deliver Hauteur's Ashes to Tuluun at Azure Watch on Azuremyst Isle.^You have done a great thing here today in your pursuit of understanding your relationship to the flame. Remember to always treat it with the utmost respect lest you get burned. I saved a portion of Hauteur's ashes for you. Use them in the creation of your fire totem and remember all that you have learned in their attainment. Now
column2: return to Tuluun.

column1: Featherbeard's Endorsement^46^Alliance^The Hinterlands^Ambassador Rualeth^Featherbeard's Journal^Featherbeard's Endorsement^^^Go to Featherbeard's Hovel and visit the dwarf if he is at home. If he is not at home
column2: search for evidence of where he can be found.^When I am finally granted an audience with Falstad Wildhammer
column3: I hope to have our strongest advocate among the Wildhammer dwarves at my side
column4: <name>. Featherbeard is revered among his people
column5: both for his legendary gryphon training skills and for his wisdom. If anyone can sway Falstad Wildhammer
column6: it is he. I would go to see him myself
column7: except that I cannot leave the confines of Aerie Peak while awaiting my audience. Visit Featherbeard at his residence to the south and ask if he will speak with me.

column1: A Gesture of Goodwill^46^All^The Hinterlands^Ambassador Rualeth^Ambassador Rualeth^^^^Ambassador Rualeth at Aerie Peak wants you to slay Witch Doctor Mai'jin and his pet spider Tcha'kaz.^The rugged terrain of the Hinterlands is not only home to the Wildhammer dwarves and their gryphons
column2: but also to a number of forest troll tribes. The trolls view the Wildhammers as squatters on their ancestral lands and spare no opportunity to accost the dwarves by attacking the gryphon aeries. One way to prove ourselves in the eyes of the Wildhammer is to help staunch these attacks by killing a Witherbark leader
column3: Witch Doctor Mai'jin
column4: who shelters in a cave at Bogen's Ledge
column5: to the west of Shadra'Alor.

column1: Preying on the Predators^44^Alliance^The Hinterlands^Ambassador Rualeth^Ambassador Rualeth^^^^Ambassador Rualeth at Aerie Peak wants you to kill 10 Mangy Silvermane and 5 Silvermane Wolves.^The Wildhammer dwarves act as companions
column2: caretakers
column3: and trainers to the gryphons. The gryphons have no shortage of enemies
column4: especially among the forest troll tribes. Sometimes
column5: though
column6: the threat comes from natural predators
column7: such as wolves. A single animal is no match for a gryphon
column8: but packs have taken to targeting gryphons more often because normal prey is scarce. Culling the wolves can help to reduce their impact on the gryphons and ingratiate us to the Wildhammer.

column1: Arelion's Mistress^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Magistrix Carinda^Magistrix Carinda^Arelion's Journal^^^Magistrix Carinda at Falcon Watch wants you to lure Viera Sunwhisper away from the settlement and then use Carinda's Scroll of Retribution on her.^With all the important matters at hand Arelion still found time in his schedule to see a mistress! It's all becoming perfectly clear. Viera Sunwhisper
column2: that filthy wench... we'll show her to never cross a magistrix again. Take this scroll and find Viera. Find a way to lure her away from town and use the scroll on her. Arelion mentioned she couldn't resist a particular wine harvested by the cenarion druids. You might find some at Cenarion Refuge
column3: just inside Zangarmarsh
column4: west of here.

column1: An Alternative Alternative^8^Draenei^Azuremyst Isle^Daedal^Daedal^^Medicinal Purpose^The Prophecy of Velen^Daedal at Azure Watch wants you to bring him 5 Azure Snapdragon Bulbs.^The girl is too far gone for mere ointments to be effective. There may be another way... The forest of Azuremyst holds many secrets
column2: one of those being a rare plant known as the azure snapdragon that some claim to be a panacea - a cure all. You can identify the plant by its stark contrast to the other plants of Azuremyst and its need to grow at the base of the azure pine trees. Make haste! And <name>
column3: be wary of the root threshers of the region as they consume snapdragon for sustenance.

column1: The Mark of the Lightbringer^58^All^Western Plaguelands^Anchorite Truuen^Anchorite Truuen^The Mark of the Lightbringer^^^Obtain the Mark of the Lightbringer and return it to Anchorite Truuen at Chillwind Camp in the Western Plaguelands.^In the short time that I have been on Azeroth I have studied many of its heroes. Of them all
column2: Uther Lightbringer stands above the rest. A hero for the ages
column3: in the end Uther was betrayed by his most promising pupil
column4: Arthas. In his honor
column5: I would like to return something he lost to his nearby tomb. It is rumored that the Scarlet Crusade is keeping one of his holy relics atop their guard tower near the gates of Hearthglen. Please
column6: <class>
column7: go and retrieve it.

column1: Reclaiming the Eggs^46^Alliance^The Hinterlands^Featherbeard's Remains^Ambassador Rualeth^Featherbeard's Endorsement^^^Gather 5 Gryphon Eggs and return them to Ambassador Rualeth at Aerie Peak.^Looking over the remains
column2: you surmise that this broken and battered skeleton must be all that is left of Featherbeard. Clutched in one skeletal hand is a torn and stained sheaf of paper. You gently remove and unroll it
column3: revealing a hand-drawn map and a few hastily scrawled notes. The map appears to be a rendering of Shadra'Alor and its three temples with 'x' marks in several places
column4: presumably the locations of the stolen eggs. You place the map in your pack for inspection at a safer location.

column1: In Pursuit of Featherbeard^46^Alliance^The Hinterlands^Featherbeard's Journal^Featherbeard's Remains^Featherbeard's Endorsement^^^Travel to Shadra'Alor and search for traces of Featherbeard.^The journal's most recent entries detail Featherbeard's concern about a growing number of Witherbark troll raids on the Wildhammer gryphon aeries and a rash of egg thefts. A search of the smaller Witherbark settlements in the area appears to have yielded no information. The last entry describes Featherbeard's suspicion that a Witherbark witch doctor named Mai'jin is behind the raids. The last
column2: hastily written sentence states the dwarf's intention to travel to Shadra'Alor in search of the eggs.

column1: Taming the Beast^10^Blood Elf^Hunter^Lieutenant Dawnrunner^Lieutenant Dawnrunner^Seek the Farstriders^^^Use the Taming Rod to tame a Crazed Dragonhawk
column2: and then return to Lieutenant Dawnrunner.^You have undoubtedly hunted and slain beasts for both your defense and sustenance
column3: yet to befriend them and harness their strengths is only now within your grasp. This I can teach you. Take this magical taming rod that allows a wild animal to temporarily bond and fight beside you. Begin with the crazed dragonhawk
column4: a nearly docile bird found just outside of Farstrider Retreat. Return to me when this is done.

column1: Taming the Beast^10^Blood Elf^Hunter^Lieutenant Dawnrunner^Lieutenant Dawnrunner^Seek the Farstriders^^^Use the Taming Rod to tame a Mistbat
column2: and then return to Lieutenant Dawnrunner.^You have done well
column3: <name>. Your understanding of the wild grows quickly. The mistbat is a clever hunter
column4: combining the swiftness of the dragonhawk and the ferocity of the springpaw. Mistbats are found just across the Elrendar River to the south
column5: preying on hapless travelers who wander into the Ghostlands. Use this final taming rod to befriend a mistbat and return to me when you have finished.

column1: Taming the Beast^10^Blood Elf^Hunter^Lieutenant Dawnrunner^Lieutenant Dawnrunner^Seek the Farstriders^^^Use the Taming Rod to tame an Elder Springpaw
column2: then return to Lieutenant Dawnrunner.^The elder springpaw is an efficient and swift hunter. In attempting to befriend one
column3: it sees you as prey. Do not be dissuaded. Use the taming rod to bring the great cat to your side and hunt beside it. They are found throughout Eversong Woods
column4: some very close to the lodge. When you have learned enough
column5: return to me.

column1: Arcane Reavers^16^All^Mage^Arcanist Vandril^Arcanist Vandril^Arcane Reavers^^^Arcanist Vandril wants you to collect 10 Arcane Fragments for him.^Arcane reavers are magical creations of brute strength. They are heavily armored and deliver stunning blows. You
column2: however
column3: can bypass their defenses and avoid their attacks. Your spellcraft is not without many advantages
column4: <name>. Travel to Dawnstar Spire and blast apart the arcane reavers. From their remains
column5: collect the crystallized fragments of magical energy and return to me. Dawnstar Spire is found to the east
column6: across the lake.

column1: A Simple Robe^16^Horde^Mage^Arcanist Vandril^Arcanist Vandril^Arcane Reavers^^^Arcanist Vandril wants you to bring him 15 Linen Cloth and a Spindleweb Silk Gland.^The arcane fragments you collected will do nicely. Nicely for what
column2: you ask? For making a splendid robe fit for a <class> like yourself! All we need now is some linen cloth and a spindleweb silk gland. You can find the silk gland from any spindleweb spider
column3: preferably after killing them.

column1: Cleansing the Scar^5^Horde^Priest^Ponaris^Ponaris^^^Garments of Spirituality^Cast Power Word: Fortitude on 6 Eversong Rangers in the Dead Scar.^<name>
column2: it is good you are here. The Scourge attack our city with such endless hate that I fear the morale of our guard is breaking. Hurry to the Dead Scar just south of the city where Jaela and her rangers stand ready. Fill them with the power of the Light through your blessings.

column1: The Rock Flayer Matriarch^63^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Ikan^Ikan^^^^Obtain Blacktalon's Claws from Blacktalon the Savage at the Great Fissure and bring it to Ikan at the Temple of Telhamat in Hellfire Peninsula.^Rock flayers are mean
column2: nasty
column3: violent creatures. But the plain ones are like tame beasts when compared to their matriarch
column4: Blacktalon the Savage. My cousin got eaten by her and it wasn't pretty. I swore that one day Blacktalon would pay for that. You bring back proof of that monster's death and I will give you my life's savings. Deal? You're going to need some friends to kill Blacktalon. Big tough friends with sharp swords. You'll find her inside a cave in the Great Fissure. Good luck!

column1: Greed^18^Horde^Rogue^Eralan^Eralan^A Discreet Inquiry^^^Eralan in Tranquillien wants you to retrieve the Pitted Gold Band from the Amani Catacombs.^A rich
column2: and I mean filthy rich
column3: merchant came through here yesterday talking about some ring of "immense archeological importance" locked in one of the countless burial chests found in the Amani Catacombs. When he wasn't talking about the ring
column4: he was talking about how much he'd pay for it. Tell you what
column5: I'll front the thieves' tools
column6: and if you manage to bring the ring back
column7: I'll pay you enough to buy ten rings of your own!

column1: Turning the Tide^70^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Force Commander Danath Trollbane^Force Commander Danath Trollbane^^^^Bring Warchief Kargath's Fist to Force Commander Danath Trollbane in Honor Hold.^The permanence of the orcish threat is one of the sad truths of Outland. There was a time when we Sons of Lothar believed we'd purchased Honor Hold's safety with our blood
column2: but there was to be no peace. The Sons will yield to no orc - green
column3: brown
column4: and now red - we will overcome them or die trying. If we are to have any expectation of victory
column5: we must take the fight to them in Hellfire Citadel. Bring me the weapon of their self-styled 'Warchief' Kargath Bladefist and you will be well rewarded.

column1: Pride of the Fel Horde^70^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Field Commander Romus^Field Commander Romus^^^^Field Commander Romus at Honor Hold wants you to kill 8 Shattered Hand Legionnaires
column2: 4 Shattered Hand Centurions
column3: and 4 Shattered Hand Champions.^We know precious little about the Fel Horde presence in Hellfire Citadel and our information has come at the cost of many lives. Fel Horde troops under the command of Kargath Bladefist are a brutal
column4: battle-hardened lot fortified by foul magics. The elite of this force
column5: the Shattered Hand legionnaires
column6: champions
column7: and centurions are feared by the regulars and serve as an officer corps. Targeting and eliminating them is a necessary first step in any successful assault on the Fel Horde's leadership.

column1: Fel Embers^70^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Magus Zabraxis^Magus Zabraxis^^^^Magus Zabraxis at Honor Hold wants you to bring her a Fel Ember.^The stuffy academics of Azeroth have cowered in their towers for too long and it's fallen to me to show them what cutting edge research is! They're afraid to play with fire and that's exactly what I intend to do
column2: once I get my hands on the fire
column3: that is. Within Hellfire Citadel's Shattered Halls
column4: Grand Warlock Nethekurse performs unrivaled magical feats augmented by the powers of a pair of strange braziers. Using the vessel he uses to contain these fel embers
column5: capture one and bring it back to me
column6: <name>.

column1: The Will of the Warchief^70^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Nazgrel^Nazgrel^^^^Bring Warchief Kargath's Fist to Nazgrel in Thrallmar.^The struggle to free the orcish people from our tainted blood has not been easy
column2: <name>. Warchief Thrall has seen too many orcish heroes laid low by fate's hand. Now
column3: it seems Kargath Bladefist numbers among them. In the Shattered Halls of Hellfire Citadel
column4: Kargath has claimed the title of 'Warchief' of the Fel Horde. With an army of crazed
column5: bloodthirsty fel orcs at his back
column6: he won't rest until Thrallmar is destroyed. Warchief Thrall has commanded us to defeat Kargath and his forces at all costs.

column1: Pride of the Fel Horde^70^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Shadow Hunter Ty'jin^Shadow Hunter Ty'jin^^^^Shadow Hunter Ty'jin at Thrallmar wants you to kill 8 Shattered Hand Legionnaires
column2: 4 Shattered Hand Centurions
column3: and 4 Shattered Hand Champions.^Overlord Maimfist's insults aside
column4: <name>
column5: this Fel Horde is nothing to be trifled with. From what we know
column6: Fel Horde troops under the command of Kargath Bladefist are a brutal
column7: battle-hardened lot fortified by foul magics. The elite of this force
column8: the Shattered Hand legionnaires
column9: champions
column10: and centurions are feared by the Fel Horde regulars and serve as an officer corps. Targeting and eliminating them is a necessary first step in any successful assault on the Fel Horde's leadership.

column1: Falcon Watch^62^Orc
column2: Undead
column3: ^Hellfire Peninsula^Martik Tor'seldori^Ranger Captain Venn'ren^Falcon Watch^^^Report to Ranger Captain Venn'ren at Falcon Watch in Hellfire Peninsula.^My people recently finished building Falcon Watch
column4: a base of operations in the southwestern region of Hellfire Peninsula - beyond Hellfire Citadel. You are welcome there as an ally
column5: <name>. If you're looking for work
column6: go there and tell Ranger Captain Venn'ren that I sent you. He will see to it that you're given tasks worthy of someone of your caliber.

column1: Falcon Watch^62^Blood Elf^Hellfire Peninsula^Martik Tor'seldori^Ranger Captain Venn'ren^Falcon Watch^^^Travel to Falcon Watch in the southwest of Hellfire Peninsula and report to Ranger Captain Venn'ren.^What are you still doing here
column2: <name>? Didn't you hear we built a proper sin'dorei outpost here in Hellfire Peninsula? Surely you'd rather be among fellow blood elves and away from all this... smell. You'll find Falcon Watch in the southwest
column3: beyond Hellfire Citadel. Report to Ranger Captain Venn'ren; he will take care of you. The road ahead is dangerous and heavily patrolled by Alliance scouts. I would recommend travelling with companions. Blood elves
column4: preferably.
