column1: Call of Water^20^Draenei^Shaman^Sulaa^Farseer Nobundo^Call of Water^^^Speak with Farseer Nobundo at the Crystal Hall inside the Exodar on Azuremyst Isle.^It's been a while since last you were tested. Farseer Nobundo has been asking for you. You must have grown greatly in wisdom because you are being called to learn the mysteries of the element of water. You remember where to find him at the Crystal Hall inside of the Exodar
column2: right?

column1: Call of Water^20^Draenei^Shaman^Farseer Nobundo^Aqueous^Call of Water^^^Speak with Aqueous in the Hidden Reef at Bloodmyst Isle.^A powerful water elemental named Aqueous has requested your presence. It would seem that there is a great imbalance occurring in the water element on Bloodmyst Isle. Not surprising given the unnatural predilections of the blood elves. You will find Aqueous in a hidden reef under the waves off the northern shore of Bloodmyst Isle. Take this potion; it can help you to get to her once you get into the water near the reef.

Call of Water^20^All^Shaman^Farseer Javad^Farseer Nobundo^Call of Water^^^Speak with Farseer Nobundo at the Crystal Hall inside the Exodar on Azuremyst Isle.^It's been a while since last you were tested. Farseer Nobundo has been asking for you. You must have grown greatly in wisdom because you are being called to learn the mysteries of the element of water. You remember where to find him at the Crystal Hall inside of the Exodar
column2: right?

column1: Call of Water^20^Draenei^Shaman^Aqueous^Aqueous^Call of Water^^^Collect 6 Foul Essences and return them to Aqueous in the Hidden Reef at Bloodmyst Isle.^In balance with the other elements
column2: water is the source and sustenance of all living things. It gives and nurtures life
column3: and all rely upon it for their existence. Yet
column4: when polluted
column5: it also brings life to an end. We must determine the extent of the damage that has been done. To the southwest is one such contaminated body of water that has come to be known as the Foul Pool. Travel there and extract the foul essence from the water spirits that inhabit the pool.

column1: Call of Water^20^Draenei^Shaman^Aqueous^Aqueous^Call of Water^^^Fill the Empty Bota Bag and then return to Aqueous in the Hidden Reef at Bloodmyst Isle.^It is worse than I feared. The corruption is very potent and if unchecked it could spread to the ocean currents and be carried throughout all of Azeroth! We are going to need a sample of the purest water to counter this malignancy. There are ruins on the untainted portion of this island
column2: to the southeast. Go there
column3: where the Wrathscale naga reside
column4: and take from their fountain. Use this bota bag to gather the sample. Hurry
column5: <name>!

column1: The Prophecy of Velen^8^Draenei^Azuremyst Isle^Daedal^Admiral Odesyus^The Prophecy of Velen^An Alternative Alternative^^Daedal wants you to travel south and seek out the people that the injured creature mentioned.^The Prophet spoke of this day: That on this island
column2: in this new world
column3: our allies would find us. "We will be tested. They will ask that we pay for the sins of our fathers..." At the time
column4: I did not understand the meaning behind his words
column5: but seeing this creature and her reaction to us
column6: it is now coming into focus. The corruption of our people has been felt even here. Venture south. It is there that we found this being. Find its kin and tell them of our people.

column1: A Small Start^7^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Admiral Odesyus^Admiral Odesyus^The Prophecy of Velen^^^Admiral Odesyus at Odesyus' Landing wants you to recover the Nautical Compass and Nautical Map stolen by the Venture Co.^I am Admiral Odesyus of Alliance Naval Command. Our ship was forced to port on your island due to an infestation of sorts. It's embarrassing to even talk about
column2: but goblins somehow managed to stow away in the holds of both of my ships. Last night
column3: while most of the ship's crew was asleep below deck
column4: they struck! Stranger still
column5: they took our navigation gear and jumped ship! They disappeared into the thicket
column6: east of here. Will you go in search of our gear? It will make for a strong gesture.

column1: Call of Water^20^Draenei^Shaman^Aqueous^Aqueous^Call of Water^^^Bring the Head of Tel'athion to Aqueous in the Hidden Reef at Bloodmyst Isle.^I have determined where the corruption is coming from. It is the by-product of some demented research and you're going to put an end to it! Just to the southwest of the Foul Pool is a small camp. There you will find the 'research' of Tel'athion the Impure. This is where he produces the filth that has been seeping into the island's water. Use the pure water you obtained from Ashenvale to destroy his cache of barrels. That will be sure to bring him out. We will have an end to this!

Call of Water^20^Draenei^Shaman^Aqueous^Farseer Nobundo^Call of Water^^^Take the Flask of Purest Water to Farseer Nobundo inside the Exodar on Azuremyst Isle.^I held back a little of the water from Ashenvale
column2: not because I doubted your ability to deal with the situation. Rather
column3: I knew that you would succeed
column4: and I wanted to make sure that you had something special to take back to Nobundo. Here
column5: <name>
column6: take this flask of pure water. It will ensure that you receive a very powerful water totem. Farseer Nobundo awaits your return at the Exodar.

column1: Cookie's Jumbo Gumbo^7^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^"Cookie" McWeaksauce^"Cookie" McWeaksauce^^^^"Cookie" McWeaksauce at the Odesyus' Landing wants you to bring him 6 Skittering Crawler Meat.^The Admiral be right
column2: ye are a resourceful one. Mayhap ye could help Cookie out? If I serve the crew chicken for dinner again
column3: I'll be sent to the brig fer sure. I noticed that thar be crawlers all along the coastline - lots o' crawlers! Bring me crawler meats and I'll be forever indebted to ya. Help a reformed pirate out?

column1: Reclaiming the Ruins^8^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Priestess Kyleen Il'dinare^Priestess Kyleen Il'dinare^^^^Priestess Kyleen Il'dinare at Odesyus' Landing on Azuremyst Isle wants you to kill 5 Wrathscale Myrmidons
column2: 5 Wrathscale Naga and 5 Wrathscale Sirens.^While some may look at our current predicament as an unfortunate turn of events
column3: I sense that we are here for a reason. The invisible hand of fate has pushed us in this direction. The reason why will become evident in time. To the west lies an ancient night elf city
column4: now in ruin and overrun with naga. It would be remiss of me to sit idly by as the naga tainted my ancestral lands. You have shown yourself a capable <class>. Honor my people and cleanse the ruins of their unwelcome inhabitants.

column1: Rune Covered Tablet^8^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Rune Covered Tablet^Priestess Kyleen Il'dinare^^^Warlord Sriss'tiz^Take the Rune Covered Tablet to Priestess Kyleen Il'dinare at Odesyus' Landing on Azuremyst Isle.^You cannot make out any of the symbols on the tablet. Perhaps the priestess would be able to decipher the mysterious runes.

Warlord Sriss'tiz^10^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Priestess Kyleen Il'dinare^Priestess Kyleen Il'dinare^^Rune Covered Tablet^^Priestess Kyleen Il'dinare at Odesyus' Landing on Azuremyst Isle wants you to kill Warlord Sriss'tiz.^A naga invasion would be disastrous
column2: <name>. I've seen what naga can do and I would not want to see such a catastrophe befall any being. If I were to guess
column3: this Warlord Sriss'tiz will be hidden in a cave - probably along the coast to the west. Find Warlord Sriss'tiz and put an end to his reign.

column1: Destroy the Legion^30^Alliance^Ashenvale^Vindicator Vedaar^Vindicator Vedaar^^^^Slay 6 Mannoroc Lashers
column2: 6 Felguards and 6 Searing Infernals
column3: and then return to Vindicator Vedaar at Forest Song in Ashenvale.^I will not tolerate their existence on this world! The Burning Legion all but destroyed our race and we fell back to settle a new home on a new world. Then they came again. And we retreated
column4: over and over. No more! There is a remnant of the Legion to the south in the regions known as Felfire Hill
column5: Demon Fall Canyon and Demon Fall Ridge. They are what is leftover from a force that once long ago invaded this world. Go and destroy as many as you can before it is too late!

column1: A Shameful Waste^28^Alliance^Ashenvale^Architect Nemos^Gnarl^^^^Bring 15 pieces of Warsong Lumber and 5 Satyrnaar Fel Wood to Gnarl at Forest Song.^Welcome to Forest Song
column2: <class>. Where you see tents
column3: there will one day be buildings
column4: but such ambitions require a steady stream of building materials. I cannot bring myself to order our workers to fell any of the ancient trees of this grove
column5: but our neighbors to the south and west have no such reverence for the forest. We shall relieve the Warsong loggers of their excess
column6: and reclaim some of the tainted wood from the satyr stronghold to the west. Bring the wood to Gnarl
column7: who will purify it for our use.

column1: Agents of Destruction^28^Alliance^Ashenvale^Sentinel Luciel Starwhisper^Sentinel Luciel Starwhisper^^^^Sentinel Luciel Starwhisper at Forest Song wants you to kill Overseer Gorthak
column2: 2 Warsong Shredders
column3: 5 Horde Deforesters
column4: and 10 Horde Scouts.^The Warsong Lumber Camp is a blight upon an embattled landscape. Every time we make progress in halting their operations
column5: Overseer Gorthak orders his loggers to redouble their efforts! Now
column6: the orcs are cutting more wood than they can possibly use
column7: leaving it to rot while their blades bite into fresh trees! This is an affront to all we stand for
column8: <name>
column9: and we will show them that we'll not suffer further destruction of our lands! Go
column10: and do not rest until Overseer Gorthak and his minions are dead!

column1: The Lost Chalice^27^Alliance^Ashenvale^Kayneth Stillwind^Kayneth Stillwind^^^^Bring the Chalice of Elune to Kayneth Stillwind at Forest Song.^The area to our west
column2: now called Satyrnaar
column3: was once a prominent shrine built by my people. It housed a priceless relic
column4: the Chalice of Elune
column5: entrusted to the shrine's keepers by the priests of Elune. Pilgrims once traveled to the shrine to experience the healing powers the chalice was rumored to hold. These stories might be nothing but old wives' tales
column6: but if there is any truth to them
column7: the relic may hold the key to rejuvenating the wounded forest. I must know
column8: <name>.

column1: Diabolical Plans^30^Alliance^Ashenvale^Diabolical Plans^Vindicator Vedaar^Diabolical Plans^^^Deliver the Diabolical Plans to Vindicator Vedaar at Forest Song in Ashenvale.^The demon dropped this parchment
column2: which is amazingly written in the Common tongue! The ones mentioned in it
column3: Diathorus and Gorgannon
column4: are the two infamous dreadlords that control the demons hereabouts. The plans detail preparations for a demonic attack on Forest Song to the north; the location where a new draenei settlement is being established. Perhaps Vindicator Vedaar at Forest Song would be interested in these?

column1: Report from the Northern Front^25^Alliance^Ashenvale^Sentinel Luciel Starwhisper^Sentinel Farsong^^^^Deliver Sentinel Luciel's report to Sentinel Farsong at Silverwing Grove.^The battle against the Warsong Lumber Camp isn't being waged from Forest Song alone
column2: <name>. There's a more substantial Silverwing Sentinel presence at Silverwing Grove to the southwest
column3: near the border with the Barrens. From the grove
column4: Sentinel Farsong directs our efforts against those who would destroy our lands. I'm a bit late in sending my latest report to Sentinel Farsong
column5: but also hesitant to leave Forest Song unattended. If your travels take you near Silverwing Grove
column6: would you deliver my report?

column1: Never Again!^32^Alliance^Ashenvale^Vindicator Vedaar^Vindicator Vedaar^Diabolical Plans^^^Kill Gorgannon and Diathorus the Seeker
column2: and then return to Vindicator Vedaar at Forest Song in Ashenvale.^<name>
column3: it falls to you to see that this attack by the Burning Legion never comes to pass. You must go and slay their leaders. Without them the rest of the demons are essentially mindless. You will find Gorgannon in Demon Fall Canyon south beyond Felfire Hill
column4: near Mannoroth's floating
column5: broken spear. Diathorus the Seeker resides somewhere in the barrow den atop Demon Fall Ridge. To find the ridge
column6: look for a ramp up from Demon Fall Canyon near the Horde's monument to Grom Hellscream.

column1: Precious and Fragile Things Need Special Handling^8^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Archaeologist Adamant Ironheart^Archaeologist Adamant Ironheart^^^^Archaeologist Adamant Ironheart at Odesyus' Landing on Azuremyst Isle wants you to bring him 8 Ancient Relics.^The priestess tells me that the ruins to the west are what's left of a night elf civilization. That got me thinking about what my pappy used to always say about night elf ruins
column2: "Sonny
column3: whenever you see night elf ruins
column4: night elf relics are sure to be close by." Now what kind of a dwarf would I be if I didn't hire the first person I saw to go digging up night elf relics for me? Now get going!

column1: Imprisoned in the Citadel^70^All^Honor Hold^Randy Whizzlesprocket^Captain Alina^^^^Rescue Captain Alina inside Hellfire Citadel before she is executed.^Alliance
column2: here?! Listen carefully
column3: <class>. Kargath has captured several of our soldiers. Captain Alina
column4: an important officer is among them. You must try to save her before she is executed. Don't worry about me
column5: I'll find a way out as soon as I catch my breath.

column1: Imprisoned in the Citadel^70^All^Thrallmar^Drisella^Captain Boneshatter^^^^Rescue Captain Boneshatter inside Hellfire Citadel before he is executed.^I was fortunate to escape Kargath's prison today
column2: <name>. Several prisoners are scheduled to be executed
column3: an important officer among them. It would be a huge blow against our forces if Captain Boneshatter was slain. You must do what you can to rescue him. I'm too weak to go on...

column1: Reclaiming Felfire Hill^30^Alliance^Ashenvale^Gnarl^Gnarl^^^^Plant 8 Tree Seedlings in the Fertile Dirt Mounds and then return to Gnarl at Forest Song in Ashenvale.^Little one
column2: to the south is an area of Nightsong Woods that has in recent times come to be called Felfire Hill. It is very sad to see the demons crawling over it
column3: spreading their corruption. Would you do something to help take back the land? I have a number of seeds that I have been saving for such a purpose. Take them to Felfire Hill and plant them in the fertile dirt mounds.

column1: All That Remains^10^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Cowlen^Cowlen^The Missing Fisherman^^^Cowlen on Azuremyst Isle wants you to recover the Remains of Cowlen's Family.^We had lived peacefully among the Owlbeasts of this island for many years. You can imagine my surprise when they stormed the beach and attacked us. I fought tooth and nail but was easily overpowered. As I blacked out from the vicious blows that I had been dealt
column2: I prayed that my family not suffer. When I awoke
column3: all was quiet. The sand was soaked red with blood - their blood. They were devoured whole. I care not for vengeance
column4: <name>. I only ask that their remains be returned to me for proper burial.

column1: A Cry For Help^10^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Magwin^Cowlen^^^^Escort Magwin through the island to her home.^My family was attacked by the murlocs and owlkin of this island several weeks ago. I managed to escape but I think that both my mother and father have been slain. I don't know what I'm going to do now
column2: but I must try and get back to my home - or what's left of it... Will you help me get through the forest?

column1: The Stone^10^Blood Elf^Warlock^Talionia^Voidstone^Return to Talionia^^^Obtain a Voidstone from the Dead Scar.^While I'm certain your imp has proven a useful and sometimes entertaining servant
column2: it is time you mastered a more powerful demon: the voidwalker. Travel down the Dead Scar until it is crossed by the Elrendar River. Just south of the river
column3: locate one of the blue glowing stones and take it. Your path will be revealed there.

column1: I've Got a Plant^9^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Admiral Odesyus^Admiral Odesyus^The Prophecy of Velen^^^Admiral Odesyus at Odesyus' Landing on Azuremyst Isle wants you to bring him a Hollowed Out Tree and 5 Piles of Leaves.^I've wondered about this for some time now
column2: but this proves it to be true. There is a traitor among us. The plans left behind by the goblins document the conspiracy. Since I don't know who it could be
column3: I'm going to need your help in finding the traitor. None of my crew can be trusted. If this is going to work
column4: I'm going to need a hollowed out tree and leaves. Search near the loggers north of us for the tree. You'll need to find the leaves by yourself. Check the forest.

column1: Tree's Company^9^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Admiral Odesyus^Admiral Odesyus^The Prophecy of Velen^^^Admiral Odesyus at Odesyus' Landing on Azuremyst Isle wants you to observe the meeting that is to take place between Geezle and the traitor.^According to the plans
column2: the traitor and the leader of the goblins
column3: Geezle
column4: are to meet at a cove on the western island. I need you to be at that meeting
column5: <name>. Remember the tree and leaves? You're going to wear them! It's a perfect disguise. Go to the cove and look for a naga flag. If the flag is there
column6: it means a meeting is planned. Use the disguise kit when you see the flag and wait. Eventually the traitor will show up. Let the meeting finish then return to me with the identity of the scoundrel.

column1: Find Keltus Darkleaf^10^Horde^Rogue^Zelanis^Keltus Darkleaf^Find Keltus Darkleaf^^The Shattered Hand^Locate Keltus Darkleaf.^<name>
column2: one of our scouts has taken too strong an interest in his duties. He surveys our enemies relentlessly
column3: but sends no reports of his findings. You must find this spy
column4: Keltus Darkleaf
column5: convince him to hand over his report and return it to me as swiftly as possible. He can be found far to the southwest
column6: where the Elrendar River forks and flows around Goldenmist Village. The night elves of An'daroth are his quarry
column7: and he won't be far from them.

column1: A Helping Hand^25^Alliance^Ashenvale^Vindicator Palanaar^Architect Nemos^^^^Make your way to Forest Song and speak with Architect Nemos.^My people have undertaken an important endeavor in the eastern part of Ashenvale
column2: with support and cooperation from the kaldorei. Under the supervision of Architect Nemos and Vindicator Vedaar
column3: they are revitalizing an old night elf outpost. The task of building won't be easy
column4: <name>
column5: for the challenges and enemies they face are many. I know Architect Nemos and his compatriots at Forest Song would appreciate any help they can get
column6: and he has asked me to send any interested <men/women> his way.

column1: Destroy the Legion^30^Horde^Ashenvale^Valusha^Valusha^^^^Slay 6 Mannoroc Lashers
column2: 6 Felguards and 6 Searing Infernals
column3: and then return to Valusha at Splintertree Post in Ashenvale.^The remains of the demonic Burning Legion have been making raids against our Warsong Lumber Camp! No more! The demons are attacking from the areas known as Felfire Hill
column4: Demon Fall Canyon and Demon Fall Ridge to the east. Go and destroy as many as you can to bring glory to both yourself and the Horde!

column1: Diabolical Plans^30^Horde^Ashenvale^Diabolical Plans^Valusha^Diabolical Plans^^^Deliver the Diabolical Plans to Valusha at Splintertree Post in Ashenvale.^The demon dropped this parchment
column2: which is amazingly written in the Orcish tongue! The ones mentioned in it
column3: Diathorus and Gorgannon
column4: are the two infamous dreadlords that control the demons hereabouts. The plans detail preparations for a demonic attack on Splintertree Post to the northwest. You're certain that Valusha at Splintertree Post would be interested in these.

column1: Never Again!^32^Horde^Ashenvale^Valusha^Valusha^Diabolical Plans^^^Kill Gorgannon and Diathorus the Seeker.^<name>
column2: you will see to it that this attack by the Burning Legion never comes to pass! Go and slay these dreadlords! Without them the rest of the demons are essentially mindless. You will find Gorgannon in Demon Fall Canyon south beyond Felfire Hill
column3: near Mannoroth's floating
column4: broken spear. Diathorus the Seeker resides somewhere in the barrow den atop Demon Fall Ridge. To find the ridge
column5: look for a ramp up from Demon Fall Canyon near the monument to Grom Hellscream.

column1: Show Gnomercy^9^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Admiral Odesyus^Admiral Odesyus^The Prophecy of Velen^^^Admiral Odesyus at Odesyus' Landing wants you to recover the Traitor's Communication from Engineer "Spark" Overgrind.^Spark must be brought to justice! I need you to go down to the beach and find that deceitful gnome. Once you find him
column2: get whatever information you can out of him! If a high ranking official of the Alliance has committed treasonous acts
column3: who knows how many others are corrupt? And <name>
column4: use force if you have to...

column1: Learning the Language^8^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Cryptographer Aurren^Totem of Akida^Learning the Language^^Saving Princess Stillpine^Read the Stillpine Furbolg Language Primer that Aurren gave you and interact with the Totem of Akida at Azure Watch.^I think I've cracked it
column2: <name>! <Aurren points to the totem.> All that we need to know about the Stillpine furbolg language is imprinted on their totems. With just a rudimentary understanding of how their symbols work
column3: we can study the totems and learn to communicate with the furbolgs. I've written down the basics of the symbol matrix on this parchment. Study it and then examine the totem. It should lead you to the next language totem. Speak to Arugoo when you return an educated <race>!

column1: Totem of Coo^10^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Totem of Akida^Totem of Coo^Learning the Language^^^Find the Totem of Coo using the clues provided to you.^You begin to read the totem
column2: barely able to pronounce the awkward words and phrases. Slowly
column3: words start to form in your head. You think that the totem is telling you to go up the nearby hill
column4: to the northeast.

column1: Totem of Tikti^10^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Totem of Coo^Totem of Tikti^Learning the Language^^^Find the Totem of Tikti using the clues provided to you.^You begin to read the totem
column2: better able to pronounce the words and phrases. Words start to form in your head. You think that the totem is telling you to go across the Crystalbrook river to the east. Perhaps your destination is on the other side of the river.

column1: Totem of Yor^10^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Totem of Tikti^Totem of Yor^Learning the Language^^^Find the Totem of Yor using the clues provided to you.^The symbols on this totem seem to translate much faster. The patterns and imagery all seem to blend into familiar words. You are fairly certain the totem is pointing you south
column2: down the river. Something is at the bottom of the river itself.

column1: Totem of Vark^10^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Totem of Yor^Totem of Vark^Learning the Language^^^Find the Totem of Vark using the clues provided to you.^You no longer see unrecognizable symbology in the totems. The totem of Yor reads to you just as easily as your native tongue. The markings identify another furbolg den
column2: due west of here. You are able to expertly decipher the language on the totem and know that your destination is Bristlelimb Village. Yor will guide you but if you get lost
column3: you know that you are able to take the ancient elven road in the forest leading west to reach your destination.

column1: Atonement^63^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Anchorite Obadei^Amaan the Wise^Atonement^Makuru's Vengeance^^Speak to Amaan the Wise at the Temple of Telhamat in Hellfire Peninsula.^Our history with the orcs is one of constant conflict
column2: <name>. We were once near driven to extinction due to their bloodlust and have since then avoided them even when not under demonic influence. Yet
column3: this retaliation... it's not what Sedai would've wanted. Speak with our elder
column4: Amaan the Wise. He will help shed light on these events.

column1: The Prophecy of Akida^10^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Totem of Vark^Arugoo of the Stillpine^Learning the Language^^Stillpine Hold^Free 8 Stillpine Captives from cages found in Bristlelimb Village. Return to Arugoo of the Stillpine at Azure Watch when you have completed this task.^The images on this totem depict a war between the Stillpine and the Bristlelimb furbolg tribes. The etchings show that the Bristlelimb have done unconscionable things to the furbolgs of Stillpine. Amidst the chaos
column2: a prophecy has begun to unfold: A hero will rise - not of furbolg blood - and save the Stillpine tribe. Slay Bristlelimb furbolgs at Bristlelimb Village for their keys. Use the keys to free the Stillpine captives. Return to Arugoo of the Stillpine when you have freed them all!

column1: The Seer's Relic^63^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Amaan the Wise^Amaan the Wise^Atonement^^^Amaan the Wise at the Temple of Telhamat in Hellfire Peninsula wants you to return to Sedai's Corpse
column2: northeast of the Temple of Telhamat
column3: and use the Seer's Relic at that location. Return to him after you've completed this task.^The stubborn close their mind and convince themselves of one truth. The wise keep an open mind to the different possibilities leading to and stemming from the present. Take this relic with you to where you found Sedai. See not with your eyes
column4: <name>
column5: but with your mind.

column1: Call of Air^30^Draenei^Shaman^Farseer Javad^Farseer Nobundo^Call of Air^^^Speak with Farseer Nobundo at the Crystal Hall inside the Exodar on Azuremyst Isle.^<name>
column2: Farseer Nobundo has been asking for you. It must be time for you to learn the secrets of air
column3: the last of the elements! I want you to know that I'm very proud of all that you have accomplished thus far. I know that you have great things ahead of you.

column1: Pilfered Equipment^17^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Clopper Wizbang^Clopper Wizbang^^^Artifacts of the Blacksilt^Bring Clopper's Equipment back to Clopper Wizbang
column2: who is hiding in a beached turtle shell.^Shh! Keep your voice down and don't call attention to me. If the murlocs detect my presence
column3: the experiment will be ruined! I've already come perilously close to contaminating my data. While I was foraging yesterday
column4: one of them must've wandered too close and discovered my camp. I returned just in time to see two of them carrying off a crate with most of my equipment! It's bound to be in one of their settlements around here
column5: but I can't risk revealing my presence. Are you willing to help?

column1: Artifacts of the Blacksilt^17^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Clopper Wizbang^Clopper Wizbang^^Pilfered Equipment^A Map to Where?^Bring 3 Crude Murloc Idols and 6 Crude Murloc Knives to Clopper Wizbang
column2: who is hiding in a beached turtle shell.^My observations and writings about the Blacksilt murlocs are quite illuminating
column3: <name>
column4: but they are just the beginning. I plan to return to Ironforge with items produced by the Blacksilts' rudimentary crafting skills. The problem is that the Blacksilt carry these items with them at all times
column5: and I can't have their blood on my conscience. If you're willing to help me gather the idols carried by Blacksilt seers and crude knives of the Blacksilt warriors and shorestrikers
column6: I won't ask how you came by them.

column1: A Map to Where?^16^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Weathered Treasure Map^Battered Ancient Book^A Map to Where?^Artifacts of the Blacksilt^^Locate the pavilion described by the map and search for what the map's maker was trying to record.^The crudely-drawn map reveals nothing of its maker
column2: but it appears to have been drawn with an unsteady hand. Wavering lines and symbols depict a small pavilion with broken columns located to the west of a partially submerged tower. If the map is to be believed
column3: this cluster of ruins appears to be located on the eastern coast of the island. You have no idea what you'll find
column4: but it was important enough for the map's creator to record.

column1: Call of Air^30^Draenei^Shaman^Sulaa^Farseer Nobundo^Call of Air^^^Speak with Farseer Nobundo at the Crystal Hall inside the Exodar on Azuremyst Isle.^<name>
column2: Farseer Nobundo has been asking for you. It must be time for you to learn the secrets of air
column3: the last of the elements! I want you to know that I'm very proud of all that you have accomplished thus far. I know that you have great things ahead of you.

column1: Call of Air^30^Draenei^Shaman^Farseer Nobundo^Velaada^Call of Air^^^Speak with Velaada at Wildwind Peak on Azuremyst Isle.^The great spirit of air calls out to you
column2: <name>
column3: and it is time for you to take heed. I wish for you to travel up the Wildwind Path on the north facing of the mountain that the Exodar has crashed into. At its peak you will find a cave and within will be one of my most accomplished pupils
column4: Velaada. Please
column5: listen to her wisdom and do as she bids. When you return you will have a greater understanding of the element of air.

column1: Call of Air^30^Draenei^Shaman^Velaada^Susurrus^Call of Air^^^Speak with Susurrus at Wildwind Peak on Azuremyst Isle.^While air may seem ethereal
column2: it is an all pervasive force
column3: covering and permeating everything around us. Though you cannot see it
column4: the rocks of this cave are composed mostly of air
column5: the waters of the oceans are saturated in it and without it
column6: fire cannot be sustained. Just don't let those elements hear you repeat that! Who you really wish to speak with for such wisdom is nearby. At the northern edge of the precipice
column7: Susurrus awaits you. It is from him that you will gain understanding.

column1: Call of Air^30^Draenei^Shaman^Susurrus^Farseer Nobundo^Call of Air^^^Return to Farseer Nobundo at the Exodar on Azuremyst Isle with the Whorl of Air.^While my brothers and sisters of the other elements have demanded that you perform various tasks
column2: I will not ask anything further of you. I think that you have done enough to 'atone' for the accident of your ship falling to this place from my skies. I can see that you have all the wisdom within you already to use the element of air wisely. Take this portion of my being back to Farseer Nobundo so that he might help you fashion your totem. And when you're ready
column3: I will fly you back down to the Exodar.

column1: Call of Fire^10^Alliance^Shaman^Prophet Velen^Farseer Nobundo^Call of Fire^^^Speak with Farseer Nobundo at the Crystal Hall in the Exodar.^I am thankful that you have chosen the difficult path of the shaman. Few enough do
column2: but I foresee it as critical to our future that we learn shamanism from the Broken. They are called that
column3: but once they were draenei. Fel magics transformed them
column4: and that is why they cannot call upon the power of the Light. Some disapprove of them and the shamanism they teach
column5: but they are not evil. I wish you to speak with Farseer Nobundo. He is the wisest shaman I know and you will learn much with his guidance.

column1: Deciphering the Book^16^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Battered Ancient Book^Anchorite Paetheus^A Map to Where?^^Nolkai's Words^Take the Ancient Journal to Anchorite Paetheus in Blood Watch.^Lacking the means to read the book's contents
column2: you think about who might be able to help you separate the author's words from the mapmaker's scrawl. Remembering Anchorite Paetheus's collection of artifacts from countless cultures
column3: you wonder if his experienced eye might be able to help you decipher the book's contents.

column1: The Longbeards^62^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Sid Limbardi^Gremni Longbeard^The Longbeards^Expedition Point^^Look for Gremni Longbeard northwest of the Den of Haal'esh
column2: to the far west of Honor Hold in Hellfire Peninsula.^We were having a problem with arakkoa bandits raiding many of our supply caravans
column3: so I hired some dwarves to take care of them. They were brothers; Gremni Longbeard was the oldest. I'm a little worried about them. Those crazy dwarves packed more ale than food or ammunition! Maybe you can go check up on them? The arakkoa's hideout
column4: the Den of Haal'esh
column5: can be found to the far west of here - beyond the Great Fissure. They set up camp northwest of there
column6: south of Dustquill Ravine.

column1: Stillpine Hold^10^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Arugoo of the Stillpine^High Chief Stillpine^Fulfilling a Promise^The Prophecy of Akida^Beasts of the Apocalypse!
column2: Murlocs... Why Here? Why Now?
column3: Search Stillpine Hold^Speak with High Chief Stillpine at Stillpine Hold.^Promised one
column4: you must travel north to the home of my people - Stillpine Hold. It is there that you will face your most daunting challenge. Go now
column5: High Chief Stillpine awaits your arrival.

column1: Beasts of the Apocalypse!^10^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Moordo^Moordo^^Stillpine Hold^Search Stillpine Hold^Moordo at Stillpine Hold on Azuremyst Isle wants you to bring him 8 Ravager Hides.^My brother and I were hunting in the woods to the east when we were ambushed by strange
column2: insect-like beasts. Such aberrations have never before been seen in Azuremyst! Could they be a sign of the coming apocalypse? The apocalypse that YOU are destined to prevent? If you truly are the Promised One
column3: you will strike the creatures of the apocalypse down... and bring me their hides. From their hides
column4: I can fashion armor of great power! Find them to the east
column5: beyond the road.

column1: Nolkai's Words^16^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Anchorite Paetheus^Mound of Dirt^^Deciphering the Book^^Find the location described in Nolkai's journal and discover his long-buried possessions.^The translation is ready now
column2: <name>. <Anchorite Paetheus points out a block of text at the end of his translation.> 'The enemy is nearly upon us. We've gathered up all the survivors and retreated to the temple to the east. It's the last ground we truly hold on the island
column3: and there is a sense among the survivors that we will make our last stand here. I've taken care to bury my last few possessions on the grounds of the temple
column4: with the hope that someone will find them and know what happened here.'

column1: Murlocs... Why Here? Why Now?^10^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Gurf^Gurf^^Stillpine Hold^Gurf's Dignity
column2: Chieftain Oomooroo^Gurf at Stillpine Hold on Azuremyst Isle wants you to recover 5 sacks of Stillpine Grain.^These are dark days
column3: Promised One. Even the murlocs are kicking our tails - literally. Unfortunately
column4: more than just my ego has been bruised. While our relationship with the Siltfin murlocs had always been tenuous
column5: never could we have imagined that they would have the gall to attack us and steal from our food stores! Travel west to the Silting Shore and recover our stolen food-stuffs! And if you see a dark-skinned murloc with a patch of white fur stuck in between his webbed toes...

column1: Gaining Mirren's Trust^62^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Mirren Longbeard^Mirren Longbeard^Gaining Mirren's Trust^^^Mirren Longbeard wants you to bring him 1 Nethergarde Bitter. You must also attain Friendly reputation with Honor Hold to complete this quest.^So you want to gain our trust? I don't trust many people these days. We lost one of our own not long ago to the arakkoa. It's got me a bit on edge. Tell you what
column2: if you can prove your loyalty to Honor Hold and... bring me a mug of Nethergarde Bitter... yes
column3: that sounds rather good about now... I'll have a deal to offer you then. Bernie at Nethergarde Keep keeps the bitter in stock.

column1: Gurf's Dignity^11^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Gurf's Dignity^Gurf^^Murlocs... Why Here? Why Now?^^Return Gurf's Dignity to Gurf at Stillpine Hold on Azuremyst Isle.^You recover the piece of fur that Gurf had "lost" in his struggle with the murlocs. Return the fur to Gurf and let him know that the fearsome Murgurgula has been slain.
Search Stillpine Hold^10^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^High Chief Stillpine^Blood Crystal^Search Stillpine Hold^Stillpine Hold^The Kurken is Lurkin'^Search Stillpine Hold for clues.^As High Chief
column2: my immediate concern is the root of the corruption in Stillpine Hold. Why did the wildkin - once our allies - attack us? Why have they taken residence in Stillpine Hold? Perhaps something inside will hold the answer. Search Stillpine Hold for clues as to the source of corruption.

column1: Blood Crystals^10^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Blood Crystal^High Chief Stillpine^Search Stillpine Hold^^^Speak with High Chief Stillpine at Stillpine Hold.^On the surface
column2: the crystal appears to be a piece of the Exodar. Something has gone terribly wrong with this crystal
column3: however
column4: as it is blood red and rapidly dissolving into the water supply of the cave. This may explain the unusually aggressive behavior of the creatures in Azuremyst. Return to High Chief Stillpine with this information.

column1: Know Thine Enemy^14^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Vindicator Aalesia^Vindicator Aalesia^^^Containing the Threat^Find the Nazzivus Monument in Nazzivian and retrieve a Nazzivus Monument Glyph. Return to Vindicator Aalesia in Blood Watch when you have one of the glyphs.^It's good to see another new face here in Blood Watch
column2: <class>. Although the blood elves are the most immediate threat
column3: there are other sinister creatures that call Bloodmyst Isle home. The Nazzivus satyr are of particular concern. They are foul
column4: demonic creatures
column5: commanding dark magics and feeding on the corruption created by the Exodar's crash. We must hold them in check
column6: but first we must learn more about them. Go southwest to Nazzivian and learn what you can from their grotesque monument.

column1: Containing the Threat^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Vindicator Aalesia^Vindicator Aalesia^On the Offensive^Know Thine Enemy^^Kill 5 Axxarien Shadowstalkers
column2: 5 Axxarien Hellcallers
column3: and Zevrax
column4: then gather 5 Corrupted Crystals and return to Vindicator Aalesia in Blood Watch.^Now that we have made our presence known to the satyr
column5: we must send a message that we will not tolerate the Burning Legion's hounds in these lands. Too long have the draenei fled in the wake of the Legion and its minions
column6: <name>. Wherever they have found us
column7: they have shown no mercy. We must not permit the satyr to exploit the Exodar's crash and use the corrupted crystals as weapons. Go north to where their leader resides in Axxarien
column8: destroy him
column9: and recover the corrupted crystals he has been gathering!

column1: The Kurken is Lurkin'^12^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Kurz the Revelator^Kurz the Revelator^The Kurken is Lurkin'^Search Stillpine Hold^Warn Your People^Kurz the Revelator at Stillpine Hold on Azuremyst Isle wants you to kill the Kurken and bring back the Kurken's Hide.^After the crystal storm had subsided
column2: a beast of myth appeared in our village. Brought here by the invading wildkin
column3: this beast
column4: the Kurken
column5: laid waste to our village. Many Stillpine were slain in defense of our lands by this fiend and many have since lost their lives attempting to subdue the beast. In my visions
column6: I have seen one defeat the Kurken. The one must be you
column7: <name>. You are our only hope. Enter Stillpine Hold and slay the Kurken. Bring me his hide as proof of deed.

column1: The Kurken's Hide^10^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Kurz the Revelator^Moordo^The Kurken is Lurkin'^^^Deliver the Kurken's Hide to Moordo at Stillpine Hold.^Take the Kurken's hide to Moordo
column2: on the other side of the village. He will fashion the hide into an item of your choice.

column1: Weaken the Ramparts^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Stone Guard Stok'ton^Caza'rez^Weaken the Ramparts^Forward Base: Reaver's Fall^^Slay Watchkeeper Gargolmar
column2: Omor the Unscarred and the drake
column3: Nazan. Return Gargolmar's Hand
column4: Omor's Hoof and Nazan's Head to Caza'rez at Thrallmar in Hellfire Peninsula.^Quick
column5: there isn't much time. Thrallmar's existence balances on the razor's edge! We're caught between Hellfire Citadel in the west and the Burning Legion to the east. With the Legion's attention turned toward the Dark Portal we must take this opportunity to strike at the fel orcs of Hellfire Citadel. The key to this is to first break through their ramparts! Go there
column6: slay their leaders
column7: and then bring back proof to Caza'rez across the room from me!

column1: Chieftain Oomooroo^11^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Stillpine the Younger^Stillpine the Younger^^Murlocs... Why Here? Why Now?^^Stillpine the Younger at Stillpine Hold on Azuremyst Isle wants you to slay Chieftain Oomooroo and 9 Crazed Wildkin.^I am Stillpine the Younger
column2: heir to the Stillpine legacy. As you can see
column3: my defenders have set up a death trap for the raving wildkin that attack from inside Stillpine Hold. While we are able to hold them off out here
column4: none of my defenders have been able to infiltrate the hold. If you could get inside and slay their leader
column5: it might give us an opportunity to strike! Find Chieftain Oomooroo and destroy him. Slay any crazed wildkin that you encounter inside as well.

column1: Victims of Corruption^14^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Morae^Morae^Catch and Release^^^Bring 6 pieces of Crystallized Bark to Morae in Blood Watch.^Bloodmyst Isle was forever changed by our arrival. The Exodar's crash scattered debris all over the islands and I think it's beginning to have an adverse effect on the wildlife. Before I can be certain of my conclusion
column2: I'll need to get a closer look. The crystals seem to have affected the trees the fastest
column3: so it seems that the treants would be the most likely to show symptoms. If you bring me samples of bark from corrupted treants
column4: I can begin my in-depth studies.

column1: Weaken the Ramparts^62^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Lieutenant Chadwick^Gunny^Weaken the Ramparts^Expedition Point^^Slay Watchkeeper Gargolmar
column2: Omor the Unscarred and the drake
column3: Nazan. Return Gargolmar's Hand
column4: Omor's Hoof and Nazan's Head to Gunny at Honor Hold in Hellfire Peninsula.^Quick
column5: <class>
column6: there isn't much time. Honor Hold's existence balances on the razor's edge! We're caught between Hellfire Citadel in the west and the forces of the Burning Legion to the east. With the Legion's attention turned toward the Dark Portal we must take this opportunity to strike at the fel orcs of Hellfire Citadel. The key to this is to first break through their ramparts! Go there
column7: slay their leaders
column8: and then bring back proof to Gunny across the hall here from me!

column1: Cruelfin's Necklace^12^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Red Crystal Pendant^Morae^^^^Bring the Red Crystal Pendant to Morae at Blood Watch.^Examining the crudely constructed pendant
column2: you notice the crystal pulsating softly. Though it emits little light
column3: you can almost feel the crystal radiating a sense of wrongness. You're not quite sure what might have possessed Cruelfin to create this pendant
column4: but the find is too important to ignore. You should probably show it to someone at Blood Watch.

column1: Searching for Galaen^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Morae^Galaen's Corpse^Searching for Galaen^^Galaen's Journal - The Fate of Vindicato^Search for Morae's husband Galaen.^Do you think often of your family
column2: <name>? There were a number of families aboard the Exodar
column3: but I've heard of very few being reunited. I
column4: myself
column5: am looking for traces of my husband Galaen
column6: who was a technician in the Cryo-Core. The wreckage of it is located to the west
column7: and it's swarming with blood elves! I must find out what became of Galaen! Even news of his death is better than never knowing. My husband will be wearing a pendant identical to my own; they were a gift from my sister.

column1: Galaen's Fate^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Galaen's Corpse^Morae^Searching for Galaen^^^Bring Galaen's Amulet to Morae at Blood Watch.^You have no means of identifying the corpse as Galaen with the information Morae gave you
column2: but the clothing appears to have been torn in search of valuables. The blood elves in the area would've claimed anything of value from the wreckage
column3: including Galaen's jeweled amulet. Although her husband did not survive the crash
column4: you believe that Morae would be grateful if you recovered her husband's amulet from the blood elves.

column1: The Bear Necessities^16^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Tracker Lyceon^Tracker Lyceon^^^^Bring 8 Elder Brown Bear Flanks to Tracker Lyceon in Blood Watch.^As I'm sure you've seen in your time on Bloodmyst Isle
column2: very little remains unchanged by our arrival. My training and experience has taught me that even the products of an environment like this one can be put to use. With so few resources
column3: we must rely on our ingenuity to provide for us. I've been supplementing our stores with meat from the bears that wander this island. With the proper preparation
column4: it can safely be eaten. If you're going to be out in the field
column5: why not help replenish our stocks?

column1: Learning from the Crystals^11^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Harbinger Mikolaas^Harbinger Mikolaas^Learning from the Crystals^^^Get an Impact Site Crystal Sample using the Crystal Mining Pick on the Impact Site Crystal and bring it to Harbinger Mikolaas in Blood Watch.^Welcome to Blood Watch
column2: <class>. Seeing to the defenses of the outpost is my primary concern
column3: but I've also been tasked with a variety of other duties by our leaders at the Exodar. The problem is that it's hardly safe to send out large amounts of researchers when the island is this dangerous. I need someone to gather a series of crystal samples from various sites on the island. The first sample I need must come from the ravager infested ship debris south of the town and across the bridge.

column1: Strength of One^10^Alliance^Warrior^Ruada^Ruada^Strength of One^^Bartleby the Drunk^Unlock the Ravager Cage and kill the Death Ravager
column2: then return to Ruada at Azure Watch in Azuremyst.^When the ship crashed
column3: our menagerie was scattered on the northeast beaches of this isle. I have been handed a key that unlocks the cage holding one of the deadlier specimens
column4: a death ravager. The creature is little armored but resistant to most magic. It must be killed by a simple blade. Take this key and release the creature from both its prison and its pain. We cannot afford to have it escape and cause even more damage to the ecology than we already have.

column1: The Second Sample^14^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Harbinger Mikolaas^Harbinger Mikolaas^Learning from the Crystals^^^Get an Altered Crystal Sample using the Crystal Mining Pick on the Altered Bloodmyst Crystal and bring it to Harbinger Mikolaas in Blood Watch.^Now that we have the baseline crystal
column2: we're going to need samples from more dangerous areas of the island to complete the set I'll be sending to the Exodar. The next sample must come from the crystals controlled by the blood elves in the Bladewood area to the northwest of Blood Watch. I have heard reports that they alter and harvest the crystals for use in some magical apparatus. See if you can find one that has not yet been incorporated into one of their devices
column3: and mine a sample from it.

column1: The Final Sample^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Harbinger Mikolaas^Harbinger Mikolaas^Learning from the Crystals^^^Get an Axxarian Crystal Sample using the Crystal Mining Pick on the Axxarien Crystal and bring it to Harbinger Mikolaas in Blood Watch.^There's just one sample remaining before I can send this set of crystals to the Exodar
column2: <name>. The final sample must come from the satyr stronghold of Axxarien to the northwest. I'm not certain what to expect from this crystal sample
column3: but I'm sure there will be some signs of corruption. Take care to mine your shard from the crystal that looks like the ones you took your previous samples from
column4: or else our researchers cannot make a valid comparison.

column1: Help Tavara^5^Alliance^Priest^Guvan^Guvan^^^Garments of the Light^Guvan at Azure Watch wants you to find Tavara and heal her wounds.^Tavara
column2: one of our herbalists
column3: has been gone far too long in her search for herbs. I fear she is hurt and in need of help
column4: yet I cannot look for her myself. Please find her and lend your healing if needed
column5: fellow <class>. She was heading east towards some hot springs when she left Azure Watch.

column1: Dark Tidings^62^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Ominous Letter^Force Commander Danath Trollbane^^^The Blood is Life^Take the Ominous Letter to Force Commander Danath Trollbane at Honor Hold in Hellfire Peninsula.^Giving the lifeless form of Vazruden the Herald the once-over
column2: you discover a rolled letter
column3: its seal yet unbroken. An elaborate "I" is pressed within the blood-red ink. Cracking the note open
column4: the message that you read is most disturbing. Force Commander Danath Trollbane back at Honor Hold will definitely want to take a look at this!

column1: Dark Tidings^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Ominous Letter^Nazgrel^^^The Blood is Life^Take the Ominous Letter to Nazgrel at Thrallmar in Hellfire Peninsula.^Giving the lifeless form of Vazruden the Herald the once-over
column2: you discover a rolled letter
column3: its seal yet unbroken. An elaborate "I" is pressed within the blood-red ink. Cracking the note open
column4: the message that you read is most disturbing. Nazgrel back in Thrallmar will definitely want to take a look at this!

column1: The Blood is Life^63^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Gunny^Gunny^^Dark Tidings^^Collect 10 Fel Orc Blood Vials and return them to Gunny at Honor Hold in Hellfire Peninsula.^That letter is going to get folks all riled up around here. They'll think there's something we might do about all those new fel orcs being created if only we knew how it was being done. It's bad enough that we have to fight the Burning Legion to the east. So
column2: it's your lucky day
column3: sweetness! You get to take a stroll into what they call the Blood Furnace inside Hellfire Citadel. Sounds hot! Get in there
column4: kill some fel orcs and bring back samples of their blood. You think you can handle that?

column1: The Blood is Life^63^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Caza'rez^Caza'rez^^Dark Tidings^^Collect 10 Fel Orc Blood Vials and return them to Centurion Caza'rez at Thrallmar in Hellfire Peninsula.^That letter is disturbing
column2: and not just because it comes from the Betrayer. We must know how they are creating these new fel orcs if we're to defeat them! It's bad enough that we must fight the Burning Legion on our eastern flank
column3: but now a new army of fel orcs to the west! You must infiltrate this Blood Furnace inside Hellfire Citadel. Bring back samples of blood from the fel orcs that you find in there.

column1: Taming the Beast^10^Draenei^Hunter^Huntress Kella Nightbow^Huntress Kella Nightbow^Seek Huntress Kella Nightbow^^^Use the Taming Totem to befriend a Barbed Crawler and return to Huntress Kella Nightbow when you have succeeded.^When the <class> first begins <his/her> path
column2: <he/she> learns only to kill. Now it seems you are ready for more. The Stillpine furbolgs have provided a means to master the skill of taming without months of study. They are able to carve a totem into the likeness of an animal
column3: which you can use to temporarily bond with a creature of that type. For your first lesson
column4: take this totem and use it on the barbed crawlers found along the western coast of the isle.

column1: Taming the Beast^10^Draenei^Hunter^Huntress Kella Nightbow^Huntress Kella Nightbow^Seek Huntress Kella Nightbow^^^Use the Taming Totem to befriend a Greater Timberstrider and return to Huntress Kella Nightbow.^The crawler was undoubtedly mean
column2: but the timberstrider will test your resolve. More powerful allies require more tenacity from the hunter. Take this taming totem and befriend a greater timberstrider. They are found in the northern reaches of Azuremyst Isle.

column1: Taming the Beast^10^Draenei^Hunter^Huntress Kella Nightbow^Huntress Kella Nightbow^Seek Huntress Kella Nightbow^^^Use the Taming Totem to befriend a Nightstalker and return to Huntress Kella Nightbow.^You probably noticed the big cats known as nightstalkers when you tamed the timberstrider. They are efficient and deadly hunters... and allies. Use this taming totem to befriend a nightstalker. Hunt with the vicious cat and keep it from harm. When you are finished
column2: return to me.

column1: Signs of the Legion^14^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Tzerak's Armor Plate^Vindicator Aalesia^^^^Kill 8 Nazzivus Satyr and 8 Nazzivus Felsworn
column2: then bring Tzerak's Armor Plate to Vindicator Aalesia in Blood Watch.^The armor scrap is forged from a deep black metal that seems to absorb light. Although it doesn't appear to be enchanted
column3: there is an unmistakable sense of wrongness about it. Such armor is only used by one force - the Burning Legion. The Legion's presence here can only mean that they're intending to mobilize the island's satyr against the draenei. Take action against the local satyr
column4: then return to Blood Watch and show this armor scrap to Vindicator Aalesia.

column1: Control^11^Alliance^Mage^Semid^Bati^^^Mirror Lake^Kill Murlocs of the Silting Shore to summon a Quel'dorei Magewraith
column2: then destroy it. Afterwards
column3: speak with Bati at the Vault of Lights in the Exodar.^You have chosen the path of the <class>
column4: and so you must learn control. Magic
column5: when unchecked
column6: can corrupt souls and destroy worlds. To fully understand
column7: you must face one who has been consumed by magic. Travel to the beaches on the northwest coast of Azuremyst Isle and use your spells to decimate the murlocs. The display of power will attract the attention of the evil force lurking there
column8: a Quel'dorei magewraith. Defeat it. When you have finished
column9: seek out Bati at the Vault of Lights in the Exodar.

column1: Redemption^12^Draenei^Paladin^Jol^Jol^Jol^^^Study the Tome of Divinity and speak with Jol.^I am responsible for putting paladins on the path to greater virtue as they devote themselves to the Light and defend our people from threats. The time has come for you to take your first step towards being truly virtuous. If you accept it
column2: I will give you a tome of divinity. In studying it
column3: you shall learn some about the Light
column4: and what is expected of you. If you understand it
column5: and are capable
column6: then you will succeed in attaining greater abilities.

column1: Redemption^12^Draenei^Paladin^Jol^Jol^Jol^^^Jol wants you to resurrect a Young Furbolg Shaman with the Symbol of Life and return to her.^Your task then
column2: <name>
column3: is to aid our new allies
column4: the Stillpine furbolgs. Several of the younger Stillpine shaman stumbled across a Bristlelimb camp and were slaughtered to the last. Take this Symbol of Life and resurrect one of the shaman. Bristlelimb Enclave is located to the east of the road just after you cross the bridge spanning Azuremyst and Bloodmyst Isle. Speak with me when you have done this.

column1: To The Bulwark^52^Horde^Paladin^Champion Bachi^Mehlar Dawnblade^To The Bulwark^^^Speak with Mehlar Dawnblade at the Bulwark.^The blood knight Mehlar Dawnblade has requested an audience with you
column2: <name>. Mehlar can be found at the Bulwark
column3: guarding the passage between Tirisfal Glades and the Western Plaguelands. He is not known for his patience. It would not be wise to keep him waiting.

column1: Deliver Them From Evil...^9^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Admiral Odesyus^Exarch Menelaous^The Prophecy of Velen^^Urgent Delivery^Deliver the Traitor's Communication to Exarch Menelaous at Azure Watch.^You must get this information to your people
column2: <name>. While your brave acts have certainly slowed down the plans of Kael'thas and his dark master
column3: the attacks will undoubtedly continue. Take the traitor's communication to your leaders. They must see this for themselves. Perhaps they will be able to better understand some of what was written.

column1: Beds
column2: Bandages
column3: and Beyond^10^Draenei^Bloodmyst Isle^Caregiver Topher Loaal^Laando^Beds
column4: Bandages
column5: and Beyond^^^Take Topher's List to Laando
column6: the Hippogryph Master at Blood Watch.^Welcome to Blood Watch
column7: <class>. Please excuse the disorder you see around you. It's easy to take simple things for granted
column8: like a fully furnished and stocked inn
column9: until you're forced to build one from nothing. We've managed to salvage this pod for a building
column10: but without the proper furnishings and first aid supplies
column11: the inn is little more than a glorified tent. Nurguni at the Exodar has offered to put together a package to help with our most immediate needs
column12: but I need someone to deliver this list to him.

column1: On the Wings of a Hippogryph^10^Draenei^Bloodmyst Isle^Laando^Nurguni^Beds
column2: Bandages
column3: and Beyond^^^Purchase a hippogryph ride to the Exodar from Laando. When you land
column4: take Topher's List to Nurguni in the Seat of the Naaru at the Exodar.^For a small fee
column5: you can rent one of my hippogryphs to fly you to the Exodar. Taking the hippogryph is a faster
column6: not to mention safer
column7: alternative for someone carrying an important message. If you'd like to take a ride
column8: speak to me again and I'll make the arrangements.

column1: Hippogryph Master Stephanos^10^Draenei^Bloodmyst Isle^Nurguni^Stephanos^Beds
column2: Bandages
column3: and Beyond^^^Find Stephanos outside the Exodar and purchase a hippogryph ride back to Blood Watch.^Here's the box
column4: <name>. That should be enough for Topher to get the inn up and running. Let him know that he can keep sending in orders as the need arises. Blood Watch urgently needs a place to care for the wounded and put up any travelers they receive. When you're ready to return to Blood Watch
column5: seek out Stephanos near the gates of the Exodar.

column1: Return to Topher Loaal^10^Draenei^Bloodmyst Isle^Stephanos^Caregiver Topher Loaal^Beds
column2: Bandages
column3: and Beyond^^^Speak with Stephanos to purchase a hippogryph ride back to Blood Watch. Once you have arrived
column4: deliver Nurguni's Supplies to Caregiver Topher Loaal.^If I remember correctly
column5: Blood Watch's hippogryph master is Laando. If you've spoken to him before
column6: then you can take one of my hippogryphs to him. That's a good lesson to know: hippogryphs are always trained to fly to their capital city
column7: but they'll only take you to a remote hippogryph master after you've already been there. Since you arrived on one of Laando's hippogryphs
column8: you can also use that route to return to Blood Watch with the caregiver's supplies.

column1: Heart of Rage^63^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Gunny^Force Commander Danath Trollbane^Weaken the Ramparts^^^Fully investigate the Blood Furnace and then report to Force Commander Danath Trollbane at Honor Hold in Hellfire Peninsula.^<class>
column2: put together a force to investigate the Blood Furnace inside Hellfire Citadel at once! And that means today
column3: princess! The magic we have at our disposal indicates that something unnatural is occurring in there. But something more powerful inside is blocking any detailed arcane investigations. It figures! You can expect heavy resistance - no other mission that we've sent in there has yet to return! Scout it entirely and then report back to the force commander with what you witness.

column1: Heart of Rage^63^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Caza'rez^Nazgrel^Weaken the Ramparts^^^Fully investigate the Blood Furnace and then report to Nazgrel at Thrallmar in Hellfire Peninsula.^<class>
column2: you must gather a group to investigate the Blood Furnace inside Hellfire Citadel at once! The magical scrying that we have at our disposal indicates that something unnatural is occurring in there. But a powerful force inside is blocking any detailed arcane investigations
column3: so it must be very important. You should expect heavy resistance - no other mission that we've sent in there has ever returned! Scout it entirely and then report back to Nazgrel
column4: advisor to Thrall
column5: with what you witness.

column1: Help Watcher Biggs^37^Alliance^Swamp of Sorrows^Anchorite Avuun^Watcher Biggs^Help Watcher Biggs^^^Find Watcher Biggs in the Swamp of Sorrows.^Magtoor has informed me that there's a stranded watcher nearby. Apparently the caravan he was escorting from Darkshire was attacked by Lost Ones. It sounds as if he's the sole survivor. He's somewhere to the south. Please
column2: <class>
column3: lend him your aid.

column1: Pool of Tears^43^Alliance^Swamp of Sorrows^Holaaru^Holaaru^^^^Obtain 5 Atal'ai Artifacts and return them to Holaaru at the Harborage in the Swamp of Sorrows.^I am interested in studying Azeroth's past and I'm wondering if you'd be willing to help? There is a nearby place of historical significance within the swamp that I would like for you to venture to. The Pool of Tears lies to the southeast. It is said that upon its shores and within its depths are buried artifacts of the Atal'ai troll civilization. But beware
column2: it is guarded by Somnus
column3: an ancient green dragon
column4: and his dragonkin
column5: as well as carnivorous fish in the pool itself!

column1: A Hearty Thanks!^8^Draenei^Azuremyst Isle^Draenei Youngling^Exarch Menelaous^^^^Speak with Exarch Menelaous at Azure Watch.^You saved my life
column2: <name>! Thank you so much! That beast would have torn me to shreds if it weren't for you. If you see the exarch at Azure Watch
column3: tell him of what you did. I'm sure he'll be pleased to hear such news!

column1: Bandits!^7^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Blood Elf Communication^Exarch Menelaous^^^^Take the Blood Elf Communication to Exarch Menelaous at Azure Watch.^This appears to be a bounty ledger. You cannot understand the blood elf language but you note that there is a picture depicting a dead draenei
column2: a smiling blood elf standing over the corpse
column3: and a symbol of what you think is some sort of blood elf currency. They've put a hit out on draenei! You must inform the exarch.

column1: Seek the Farstriders^10^Blood Elf^Hunter^Kary Thunderhorn^Lieutenant Dawnrunner^Seek the Farstriders^^^Speak with Lieutenant Dawnrunner at Farstrider Retreat.^Lieutenant Dawnrunner at Farstrider Retreat has requested an audience with all able hunters. It would greatly benefit you to seek her out
column2: <name>. She is a beacon of wisdom for those of our calling. Farstrider Retreat lies south of Silvermoon City.

column1: Return the Reports^10^Horde^Rogue^Keltus Darkleaf^Zelanis^Find Keltus Darkleaf^^^Bring Keltus Darkleaf's Reports to Zelanis in Silvermoon City.^Your sleight of hand was most impressive. There's no question that I can trust you to take these reports to Zelanis.
The Rune of Summoning^10^Blood Elf^Warlock^Voidstone^Talionia^Return to Talionia^^^Use the Voidstone to summon a Voidwalker in Goldenmist Village
column2: defeat it
column3: and return to Talionia in Silvermoon City.^The voidstone reveals a vision of a multi-story building haunted by ghostly figures. As the scene sharpens and blurs
column4: other buildings come into view
column5: leading you to believe it is Goldenmist Village. Rooftops and tree canopies suddenly flash by
column6: revealing the way to Goldenmist by following the Elrendar River to the west. Once there
column7: use the voidstone near the rune of summoning atop the center building and defeat the summoned voidwalker. Only then can you return to your teacher.

column1: The Missing Survey Team^14^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Harbinger Mikolaas^Draenei Cartographer^Learning from the Crystals^^^Harbinger Mikolaas wants you to find the Survey Team he sent to the Ruins of Loreth'Aran and assist them in any way you can.^As we've gotten ourselves established here at Blood Watch
column2: I've been sending out survey teams to create more reliable maps of the island. In most cases
column3: they returned unharmed with the data we need
column4: but the team I sent east to the ruins hasn't reported back. I worry about what might have happened to them
column5: but I can't spare the men to send another mission after them. Find them
column6: <name>
column7: and lend them any assistance they require to return with their survey data.

column1: Envoy to the Horde^21^Blood Elf^Undercity^Lor'themar Theron^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner^Hero of the Sin'dorei^^^Bring the Letter from Lor'themar Theron to Lady Sylvanas Windrunner in Undercity
column2: the Forsaken capital in Tirisfal Glades.^There were doubts about our capabilities among our potential new allies. Of what use could we be to them when perceived as unable to deal with our problems at home? This changes everything. No longer will our power be questioned. We'll be able to join the Horde as equals. Take this letter to Sylvanas
column3: ruler of the Forsaken. She's already on our side but the news of Dar'Khan's death will be music to her ears. Prepare for a long trip
column4: <name>. If all goes well she will send you to Orgrimmar.

column1: Warn Your People^11^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^High Chief Stillpine^Exarch Menelaous^^The Kurken is Lurkin'^^Speak with Exarch Menelaous at Azure Watch.^The Hold is saved and soon my people will make their way back to the ancestral home. The prophecy has come to pass and a new age of prosperity begins for the Stillpine. But I fear that darkness looms ahead for your own people. There are questions left unanswered - visions of prophecy unseen. Return to your leaders and tell them of what you have seen here. And Promised One
column2: should you ever require the aid of Stillpine
column3: you have merely to ask.

column1: Coming of Age^11^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Exarch Menelaous^Torallius the Pack Handler^Coming of Age^^^Exarch Menelaous at Azure Watch has asked that you deliver the Exarch's Orders to Torallius the Pack Handler
column2: standing outside of the Exodar.^You have survived the wilds of our new home and shown yourself a cut above the others. I believe that you have come of age to assist those battling on the front lines of Bloodmyst. The Hand of Argus could use a <race> like you. Report to Torallius the Pack Handler. You will find him outside the Exodar
column3: tending to the elekk. Give him these orders so that he may direct you towards your new duties on Bloodmyst.

column1: A Favorite Treat^12^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Aonar^Aonar^^^^Aonar at Kessel's Crossing wants you to bring him 10 Sand Pears.^I've made a wonderful discovery
column2: <class>. On the uncorrupted part of the island grows a remarkable fruit called the sand pear. They're found near the bottoms of the trees. I've been preparing pies from them
column3: but if I'm not careful
column4: the elekk will start to wander over and steal my fruit. I've taken to gathering enough to share with the animals
column5: but my stores are gone and the craving for pie has returned. Would you be willing to help gather the fruit I need for another batch of pies? I promise I'll share!

column1: Elekks Are Serious Business^11^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Torallius the Pack Handler^Vorkhan the Elekk Herder^Coming of Age^^Alien Predators^Speak with Vorkhan the Elekk Herder on Bloodmyst Isle.^Is he crazy? Entrusting something like this to some no-named <race> youngling! Just remember this kid: You'll never make it as a Hand of Argus! You don't have the guts! I guess I'll have to humor him this time. Speak with Vorkhan at Kessel's Crossing on Bloodmyst Isle. Just follow the road north from here
column2: and when it forks
column3: just keep on going north.

column1: Meeting the Warchief^21^Blood Elf^Orgrimmar^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner^Thrall^Hero of the Sin'dorei^^^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner wants you to take the Letter Sealed by Sylvanas to Thrall in Orgrimmar
column2: capital of Durotar.^I haven't lost any love for my homeland or its people
column3: as you know. I've fought tooth and nail for Silvermoon to be allowed a place beside Undercity and Orgrimmar at the negotiating table. This should silence any opposition. Take this letter to Thrall in Orgrimmar. As leader of the Horde he will have the final say on accepting your race's pledge. I've added my own seal to the letter as a personal endorsement. Go northwest of the city and board the zeppelin bound for Durotar at the tower.

column1: Allegiance to the Horde^21^Blood Elf^Silvermoon City^Thrall^Lor'themar Theron^Hero of the Sin'dorei^^^Return to Silvermoon City and report back to Lor'themar Theron.^Your people suffered a great betrayal by the Alliance. You've succeeded in fending off Darnassian attacks as well as spies from Ironforge. Now you've defeated a powerful Scourge leader at the footsteps of your home. Your worthiness is no longer in question. It is now apparent that you need us and we need you. Return to Lor'themar. Tell him I received his message loud and clear. <The warchief crushes the letter inside his palm.> Welcome to the Horde
column2: elf.

column1: Salvaging the Data^14^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Draenei Cartographer^Harbinger Mikolaas^Learning from the Crystals^^^Obtain the Survey Data Crystal from the Wrathscale near the dead cartographers and return it to Harbinger Mikolaas at Blood Watch.^It's too late to assist the cartographers in completing their mission
column2: but it appears they collected the data Harbinger Mikolaas was expecting. The crystal storing their survey information was not among their ransacked packs
column3: so it must be in the hands of the Wrathscale naga. You know that Harbinger Mikolaas will be saddened by the loss of the survey crew
column4: but would want to salvage the survey data.

column1: Catch and Release^13^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Morae^Morae^Catch and Release^^^Morae at Blood Watch wants you to 'mark' 6 Blacksilt Scouts using the Murloc Tagger.^The Blacksilt murlocs on the southwestern coast are curious creatures. In some ways
column2: they act barely sentient
column3: yet in others
column4: they show a remarkable degree of organization. I have a few theories about that
column5: but no real way to test them until recently. I've devised a method that will allow me to track the murlocs I'm interested in without doing any lasting harm or interfering with their natural behavior. If you're willing to help with the marking
column6: I'll gladly pay you for your assistance.

column1: Medivh's Journal^70^All^The Violet Eye^Archmage Alturus^Wravien^Medivh's Journal^^^Archmage Alturus at Deadwind Pass wants you to go into Karazhan and speak to Wravien.^Your name is getting around
column2: <name>. You've made your way into and out of Karazhan - more than most mortals can claim. I need to ask a special favor of you. As part of our research
column3: the Violet Eye has been trying to track down Medivh's own journal. Unfortunately
column4: none of the agents we've sent inside have come out. Wravien was the last to be sent; see if you can find him and see about any leads on the journal.

column1: A Colleague's Aid^70^All^Netherstorm^Archmage Alturus^Kalynna Lathred^Medivh's Journal^^^Take the Charred Bone Fragment to Kalynna Lathred at Area 52 in Netherstorm.^There is a small detail I've forgotten to take into account. The residue of Medivh's essence contained in this bone fragment is completely devoid of life - just like Arcanagos. There is a way
column2: however. And I know just the person to help us. Travel to Area 52 in Netherstorm and show the bone fragment to Kalynna Lathred. She will know just what to do.

column1: Newfound Allies^15^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Anchorite Paetheus^Huntress Kella Nightbow^Newfound Allies^^^Take the Letter of Introduction to Huntress Kella Nightbow in Azuremyst Isle.^Harbinger Mikolaas has done a commendable job of safeguarding Blood Watch
column2: <class>
column3: but our enemies are many and our resources few. Our weakness is well known to our enemies
column4: but your contact with the forces of the Alliance is something they haven't accounted for. I have prepared a letter of introduction to the people of Auberdine
column5: the closest Alliance settlement
column6: proposing cooperation in the fight against our foes. Take it with you and seek out Huntress Kella Nightbow near the docks west of the Exodar.

column1: The Way to Auberdine^15^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Huntress Kella Nightbow^Thundris Windweaver^Newfound Allies^^^Take the boat from the dock near Huntress Kella Nightbow to Auberdine. Once you have arrived in Auberdine
column2: take the Letter of Introduction to Thundris Windweaver.^If you wait out on the dock
column3: you'll see the boat arriving from the port of Auberdine in Darkshore. Once it has offloaded its passengers
column4: you'll be able to board. After a short journey
column5: the boat will put in at Auberdine and you'll be able to deliver your message. It's probably best to take this to Thundris Windweaver
column6: an old friend of mine and a well-respected citizen of the town.

column1: Alien Predators^11^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Vorkhan the Elekk Herder^Vorkhan the Elekk Herder^^Elekks Are Serious Business^^Kill 10 Bloodmyst Hatchlings then return to Vorkhan the Elekk Herder at Kessel's Crossing on Bloodmyst Isle.^One thing we've learned in our travels is that extreme care must be taken when introducing wildlife from one world to another. When the Exodar crashed
column2: it was carrying specimens of various Outland species
column3: including an insectoid predator called the ravager. Some of the specimens were lost
column4: but many others survived and took to the wild. If we don't keep them in check
column5: they will upset the natural balance here on the islands. You'll find these ravagers to the west of Kessel's Crossing
column6: near the coast.

column1: The Zapthrottle Mote Extractor!^60^All^Engineering^Mack Diver^Mack Diver^^^^Bring 15 Steam Pump Parts to Mack Diver at Zabra'jin in Zangarmarsh.^The swamp gas is truly amazing
column2: and can be very useful
column3: mon! But first
column4: you gotta be able to suck it up
column5: and that
column6: my friend
column7: requires a Zapthrottle Mote Extractor. Now
column8: I could just give you the schematics
column9: but I'll need something in return first. How about some spare parts? Last time I checked
column10: there were plenty laying around near the broken steam pump at the Dead Mire
column11: far to the northeast. I heard that the withered giants spread the pieces all over that dried-out lake bed.

column1: The Zapthrottle Mote Extractor!^60^Alliance^Engineering^K. Lee Smallfry^K. Lee Smallfry^^^^Bring 15 Steam Pump Parts to K. Lee Smallfry at Telredor in Zangarmarsh.^Have you seen the swamp gas? Isn't it just shiny? It takes a Zapthrottle Mote Extractor to suck 'em dry though. I could give you the plans to make one
column2: but I really need some spare parts to fix stuff 'round here. Last time I checked
column3: there were plenty of parts laying around near the steam pump at the Dead Mire to the northeast. I think the withered giants broke the pump out there. Shall we help each other out?

column1: Kalynna's Request^70^All^Netherstorm^Kalynna Lathred^Kalynna Lathred^Medivh's Journal^^^Kalynna Lathred wants you to retrieve the Tome of Dusk from Grand Warlock Nethekurse in the Shattered Halls of Hellfire Citadel and the Book of Forgotten Names from Darkweaver Syth in the Sethekk Halls in Auchindoun.^I left the Kirin Tor in pursuit of knowledge forbidden by those of my order; it is beyond ironic that I am now asked to assist them with that very same knowledge. If I'm to perform this favor for you
column2: you will have to do something for me first. I want you to obtain two of the tomes I've been searching for. The first one is called the Tome of Dusk and is owned by the orc warlock known as Nethekurse. The second
column3: known as the Book of Forgotten Names
column4: belongs to the arakkoa known as Darkweaver Syth.

column1: In Good Hands^70^All^The Violet Eye^Wravien^Gradav^Medivh's Journal^^^Speak to Gradav at the Guardian's Library in Karazhan.^Was I supposed to be looking for this journal? It can't be... I don't quite recall... Of course! It is Gradav you're thinking of. He was looking for the book when I got here. Surely he must've found it by now; why don't you go ask him about it? I'd lend you a hand... but these books are just so... interesting!
Kamsis^70^All^The Violet Eye^Gradav^Kamsis^Medivh's Journal^^^Speak to Kamsis at the Guardian's Library in Karazhan.^Journal
column2: what journal? You're thinking of Kamsis
column3: surely. Go and ask her about it. I can't leave my project right now or all my work will be wasted!

column1: The Shade of Aran^70^All^The Violet Eye^Kamsis^Kamsis^Medivh's Journal^^^Obtain Medivh's Journal and return to Kamsis at the Guardian's Library in Karazhan.^Let me think for a second. The Violet Eye... Medivh's Journal... Why yes
column2: it's all coming back to me now. I believe I had the journal you're looking for before I started to read these scrolls... Aran... yes
column3: Aran asked me for the book. So nicely too. I just had to give it to him. He's Medivh's father after all
column4: did you know?

column1: Irradiated Crystal Shards^15^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Vindicator Boros^Vindicator Boros^^^More Irradiated Crystal Shards^Vindicator Boros at Blood Watch wants you to bring him 10 Irradiated Crystal Shards.^The Exodar's crash scattered pieces of fouled crystals all over Bloodmyst Isle
column2: corrupting the water and the landscape. We've even begun finding pieces of the crystals inside the flesh of animals taken for meat. I've uncovered a way to purify the shard and turn them into functional crystals
column3: so if you bring me enough shards
column4: I'll trade one of my completed crystals for them. So far I've found the shards in the bodies of bears
column5: ravagers
column6: flutterers
column7: and treants inhabiting the corrupted part of the island.

column1: Constrictor Vines^15^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Tracker Lyceon^Tracker Lyceon^^^Culling the Flutterers^Tracker Lyceon at Blood Watch wants you to bring him 6 Thorny Constrictor Vines.^A good woodsman makes use of every available resource
column2: <class>. Even the most bizarre creatures possess attributes we can use to our advantage. With Blood Watch under constant assault from the Sunhawks
column3: we're looking to a variety of natural defenses including traps. The lasher's thorny vines are perfectly suited to the construction of the traps I have in mind.
