The combination of sharp spines and deadly toxin will fell unwary attackers. Bring me the vines of mutated constrictors so that I can begin my work.

column1: Nightbane^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Kalynna Lathred^Archmage Alturus^Medivh's Journal^^^Go to the Master's Terrace in Karazhan and touch the Blackened Urn to summon Nightbane. Retrieve the Faint Arcane Essence from Nightbane's corpse and bring it to Archmage Alturus.^You fulfilled your end of the deal. I will now bind your essence to that of the dead blue dragon. There is an urn in the Master's Terrace
column2: should you touch that urn
column3: you'll now release its energy anl bring life back to the charred remains of Arcanagos. Defeat the creature and retrieve its essence immediately! You will need to take it to Alturus. Should you fail
column4: the stars predict you will have let a great terror loose upon the skies. A terror known as Nightbane!

column1: The Master's Terrace^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Kamsis^Archmage Alturus^Medivh's Journal^^^Go to the Master's Terrace in Karazhan and read Medivh's Journal. Return to Archmage Alturus with Medivh's Journal after completing this task.^Journal? What journal? Oh
column2: right. That journal! The Violet Eye sent me here for it. It's all coming back now. <Kamsis points to a page in the journal.> This is the page that Alturus is interested in. Did you know that while other people's journals serve as a record of their memories
column3: Medivh's is literally just that? Try it. Go to the Master's Terrace and read the page; you'll see just what I mean. Might as well report to Alturus while you're at it. I'm afraid I'll be here for a while.

column1: WANTED: Deathclaw^17^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Wanted Poster^Harbinger Mikolaas^^^^Bring Deathclaw's Paw to Harbinger Mikolaas in Blood Watch.^By order of Harbinger Mikolaas: A bounty of 18 silver to be paid to the brave soul who returns with proof of the marauding bear Deathclaw's demise. Deathclaw should be considered extremely dangerous and is responsible for the killing of a survey team on the coast to the northwest of Blood Watch. Travelers are advised to avoid the area.

Culling the Flutterers^16^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Tracker Lyceon^Tracker Lyceon^^Constrictor Vines^^Tracker Lyceon at Blood Watch wants you to kill 10 Royal Blue Flutterers.^When we first encountered flutterers
column2: they showed few signs of mutation. As the corruption got progressively worse
column3: the moths and other species began to show signs of contamination. It has progressed to the point where they damage nearly everything they come in contact with. They're amplifying the damage being done by the crystal shards scattered by the Exodar's crash. We have no choice but to begin culling their population in the lands north of Blood Watch.

column1: Mac'Aree Mushroom Menagerie^14^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Jessera of Mac'Aree^Jessera of Mac'Aree^^^Ysera's Tears^Jessera of Mac'Aree at Blood Watch wants 1 Aquatic Stinkhorn
column2: 1 Blood Mushroom
column3: 1 Ruinous Polyspore
column4: and 1 Fel Cone Fungus.^Did you know mushroom hunting is far more dangerous than mushroom consumption? Mushroom hunters expose themselves to many unknowns - not including potential wildlife dangers! What would life be without a little danger? I am in need of mushrooms for my collection. Scattered throughout these unexplored wilds you will find four different types: An aquatic stinkhorn
column5: a blood mushroom
column6: a ruinous polyspore
column7: and a fel cone fungus. They are each unique to various regions in Bloodmyst. Bring them to me.

column1: Ysera's Tears^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Jessera of Mac'Aree^Jessera of Mac'Aree^^Mac'Aree Mushroom Menagerie^^Jessera of Mac'Aree at Blood Watch wants 2 Ysera's Tears.^Good to see you again
column2: <name>! You were exceptionally efficient in completing the last task that I offered you. Perhaps you would be interested in another? To the northeast lies Wyrmscar Island
column3: home to a rare species of mushroom known as Ysera's tear - named after the green dragonlings that inhabit the island. I only require a small sampling of the mushroom
column4: but I must warn you that the denizens of the island do not welcome visitors. Tread carefully.

column1: The Kessel Run^12^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Kessel^Kessel^The Kessel Run^^^Kessel at Kessel's Crossing wants you to warn High Chief Stillpine at Stillpine Hold
column2: Exarch Menelaous at Azure Watch and Admiral Odesyus at Odesyus' Landing of the imminent blood elf invasion. Return to Kessel when you complete this task. You have 15 minutes. (Be sure to keep it out of water.)^You're just in time
column3: <name>. Blood elf activity in this area has doubled in the past week. Our agents have informed us that the blood elves that call themselves Sunhawks plan to launch an offensive upon Azuremyst soon. I need you to get a warning out to our allies and compatriots. Warn High Chief Stillpine at Stillpine Hold
column4: Exarch Menelaous at Azure Watch and Admiral Odesyus at Odesyus' Landing. Time is of the essence so I am lending you my elekk. Be sure to keep it out of water.

column1: Establishing New Outposts^60^Alliance^Eastern Plaguelands^Emissary Whitebeard^Emissary Whitebeard^^^^Capture Crown Guard Tower
column2: Eastwall Tower
column3: Northpass Tower and Plaguewood Tower in the Eastern Plaguelands
column4: then return to Emmisary Whitebeard at Light's Hope Chapel.^Welcome to the Plaguelands
column5: <name>. As you know
column6: the Forsaken and their allies hold the lands to the west of here against our best efforts. The Alliance commanders have decided that here in the east
column7: we will establish new fortifications to tighten the noose around our enemies. Towers long abandoned since the days of Lordaeron are to be seized and rebuilt for this purpose. These lands are dangerous
column8: and we could use your help.

column1: Bolstering Our Defenses^60^Horde^Eastern Plaguelands^Emissary Gormok^Emissary Gormok^^^^Capture Crown Guard Tower
column2: Eastwall Tower
column3: Northpass Tower and Plaguewood Tower in the Eastern Plaguelands
column4: then return to Emmisary Gormok at Light's Hope Chapel.^Agents of the Forsaken uncovered an Alliance plot to establish new bases here in the Eastern Plaguelands
column5: at abandoned towers throughout the area. It is imperative that we not allow them to establish a significant presence on our eastern borders
column6: and so we must stave off this Alliance incursion. Our current plans are to drive them out of any towers they may have already seized
column7: and occupy those that we have under our control against further attacks.

column1: Declaration of Power^13^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Kessel^Kessel^The Kessel Run^^^Kessel at Kessel's Crossing on Bloodmyst Isle wants you to kill Lord Xiz at Wrathscale Lair and drive the Draenei Banner through his dead body.^Have you seen the serpent men? The ones that call themselves naga? <Kessel spits.> They dared make an advance upon this camp under cover of darkness only three nights ago. Can you believe the audacity of those primitive beasts? I need you to deliver a message to their leadership
column2: <name>. To the northeast is Wrathscale Lair
column3: home to Lord Xiz. Find him
column4: slay him where he stands and drive this banner through his corpse. Let them know fear whenever they should see our standard!

column1: Saving Princess Stillpine^13^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Princess Stillpine^Stillpine Ambassador Frasaboo^^Learning the Language^^Release Princess Stillpine from her cage and then speak with Stillpine Ambassador Frasaboo at Blood Watch.^Help me
column2: <name>! The Bristlelimb captured me and are planning to sacrifice me to their foul gods! High Chief Bristlelimb holds the key that opens the cage. To force him to appear
column3: you must slaughter the evil Bristlelimb furbolgs that inhabit the enclave
column4: just two camps to the west of this camp. If you kill enough of them
column5: he will surely come for vengeance! When he shows up
column6: kill him and get the key! My father will richly reward you if you can save me!

column1: Report to Exarch Admetius^13^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Kessel^Exarch Admetius^The Kessel Run^^^Speak with Exarch Admetius at Blood Watch.^A Hand of Argus soldier is many things: Obedient
column2: brave
column3: intelligent
column4: and above all
column5: honorable. You may yet exhibit some of these traits
column6: <class>. Report to Exarch Admetius at Blood Watch if you are still interested in joining the Hand. He and his subordinates will further train you in the ways of the draenei soldier. And remember this
column7: <name>: Honorable people do not always perform honorably. Sometimes they cannot. You will find Blood Watch just up this road
column8: to the north.

column1: The Missing Expedition^19^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Achelus^Achelus^^^^Kill 8 Myst Spinners
column2: 8 Myst Leechers and their leader
column3: Zarakh. Return to Achelus at Blood Watch when the task is complete.^About a week ago
column4: my research team and I were out exploring the western wilds of Bloodmyst when we were attacked by bloodthirsty spiders. The effect of the crystal contamination was clearly evident as these spiders were massive and extremely aggressive. I managed to escape but my team wasn't so lucky. We must not let the same fate befall others. Go west to the Amberweb Pass and destroy the spiders and their matriarch
column5: Zarakh.

column1: They're Alive! Maybe...^19^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Researcher Cornelius^Researcher Cornelius^^^^Researcher Cornelius has asked that you free 5 Expedition Researchers.^It was a bloody mess
column2: <name>. We were ambushed by a large pack of these spiders. Their progenitor descended upon us with incredible speed and wrapped us up in cocoons. After we were webbed
column3: she began to lay eggs near us. We were to be food for her young! FOOD! I managed to cut my way out and escape but I will not leave the others behind. So far I've been unsuccessful in nearing the pass. Would you lend a hand? Destroy those cocoons! Hopefully some of our team is still alive!

column1: The Bloodcurse Legacy^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^A Letter from the Admiral^Captain Edward Hanes^The Bloodcurse Legacy^Urgent Delivery^The Bloodcursed Naga^Admiral Odesyus has asked that you find and speak with Captain Edward Hanes.^Dear friend
column2: My hand trembles as I ink this letter. I pray that it reaches you in time. Last night
column3: Edward Hanes
column4: captain of the ship 'Lost Hope'
column5: appeared before me in my tent. The same Edward Hanes that died of scurvy 20 years ago. This apparition told me a tale that made my heart tremble. A tale that I need you to hear and a mission that I need you to accomplish. Will you do it? Will you seek out Edward on Wyrmscar Island
column6: northeast of your base? Regards
column7: Admiral Odesyus

column1: Beast Training^10^Blood Elf^Hunter^Lieutenant Dawnrunner^Halthenis^Seek the Farstriders^^^Speak with Halthenis in Silvermoon City.^Beyond bonding with your chosen pet
column2: there remains the intricacies of caring and training it. For this
column3: Halthenis the beast trainer of Silvermoon City can show you the way. He always shows the utmost respect for my students
column4: if they do the same for him. Do not disappoint me.

column1: The Bloodcursed Naga^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Captain Edward Hanes^Captain Edward Hanes^The Bloodcurse Legacy^^^Captain Edward Hanes on Wyrmscar Island wants you to kill 10 Bloodcursed Naga.^They say when the world was sundered
column2: this land cried the loudest. It was here that thousands of night elves faded into oblivion and in their place rose terrible creatures of hate - the naga. Obedient to their twisted queen
column3: Azshara
column4: they would destroy all that would dare pass through their sea. It would remain this way for thousands of years - until now. The first order of business is to remove the bloodcursed naga from the reef.

column1: Beast Training^10^Draenei^Hunter^Huntress Kella Nightbow^Ganaar^Seek Huntress Kella Nightbow^^^Speak with Ganaar at the Traders Tier of the Exodar.^Oh
column2: one more thing! You'll want to speak with Ganaar at the Exodar. He'll be able to teach you the last bits of knowledge necessary to care for your pet and train it. You can find him in the southwest corner of the Traders Tier.

column1: Paladin Training^1^Blood Elf^Paladin^Magistrix Erona^Jesthenis Sunstriker^^Reclaiming Sunstrider Isle^Well Watcher Solanian^Speak with Jesthenis Sunstriker - the Paladin class trainer - inside the Sunspire on Sunstrider Isle.^As you advance within your class
column2: you will want to take advantage of the training that your class trainer can provide you. For young paladins here on Sunstrider Isle
column3: your trainer is Jesthenis Sunstriker. Speak with Jesthenis and see what training he has available for you. The things he will teach do have a cost
column4: so bring some coin with you. Your trainer - as with all the trainers on Sunstrider Isle - is inside the Sunspire on the lower level.

column1: Summons from Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^12^Blood Elf^Paladin^Noellene^Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^Summons from Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^^^Speak with Knight-Lord Bloodvalor in Farstriders' Square in Silvermoon City.^<name>
column2: you have excelled in your early training and distinguished yourself among those who would become Blood Knights. You are ready to undertake the next phase of your training and
column3: to that end
column4: Knight-Lord Bloodvalor himself has asked to speak with you. I have no doubt that Knight-Lord Bloodvalor wishes to set a trial for you to test your abilities and training. You will find him in the Blood Knight headquarters in Silvermoon City's Farstriders' Square. I wish you well
column5: <name>.

column1: The First Trial^12^Blood Elf^Paladin^Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^Summons from Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^^^Travel to the island Knight-Lord Bloodvalor described
column2: find the cave
column3: and light the brazier. When the First Trial is over
column4: return to Knight-Lord Bloodvalor in Silvermoon City.^You have learned much of combat and bloodshed
column5: initiate
column6: but there is much more to our order. Mastery of the Light requires a focused mind and tremendous willpower. Without these
column7: you are little better than a street thug. There is an island in the northeastern reaches of the Ghostlands
column8: called the Isle of Tribulations
column9: that we use to hone these skills. You will find a brazier within a shallow cave there. Kneel before the brazier
column10: light it
column11: and focus on what you see before your eyes.

column1: Digging Up the Past^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Archmage Alturus^Archmage Alturus^Medivh's Journal^^^Archmage Alturus wants you to go to the mountains south of Karazhan in Deadwind Pass and retrieve a Charred Bone Fragment.^Kamsis was right! This information is extremely important. If Medivh weaved his own essence into the magic he used to defeat the dragon
column2: it is quite possible we could retrieve even a faint residue of that essence from the dragon's remains. What great insight may lie beneath the ashes of Deadwind Pass
column3: awaiting discovery. Go to the mountains south of Karazhan and bring me back a bone fragment of seemingly draconic origin.

column1: A Study in Power^12^Blood Elf^Paladin^Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^Magister Astalor Bloodsworn^Summons from Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^^^Speak with Magister Astalor Bloodsworn in the hidden chamber beneath Blood Knight headquarters.^Do not think me unduly harsh
column2: <name>. Stillblade knew well what he was being sent to do. He understood and accepted his duty and is an example for all aspiring Blood Knights. My words are no eulogy
column3: <name>. Stillblade's service to us is far from over and you will be the instrument of his resurrection. Your education in the order's ways has just begun. With the betrayal of Kael'thas and the loss of our power source
column4: you must learn new methods of wielding the Light. Seek out Magister Astalor Bloodsworn.

column1: The Hopeless Ones...^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Captain Edward Hanes^Captain Edward Hanes^The Bloodcurse Legacy^^^Captain Edward Hanes on Wyrmscar Island wants you to recover 4 Bloodcursed Souls.^On a ledge of the reef
column2: deeper than where you found the bloodcursed naga
column3: you will find the hopeless ones: The bloodcursed voyagers
column4: ghosts of those taken by the bloodcurse. It is regrettable
column5: what I ask of you now... but they must be destroyed and their cursed shells brought back to me. Their souls must be put to rest. Return to me when you have done as asked and I shall give you one final task.

column1: Ending the Bloodcurse^19^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Captain Edward Hanes^Captain Edward Hanes^The Bloodcurse Legacy^^^Captain Edward Hanes on Wyrmscar Island wants you to destroy the Statue of Queen Azshara and kill Atoph the Bloodcursed.^To the south you will find Bloodcurse Isle. Atop the island you will find a shrine dedicated to the beloved queen of the naga
column2: Azshara. Destroy the statue - burn it in effigy! This will surely draw the ire of Atoph
column3: the Bloodcursed leader. Slay Atoph and return to me!

column1: Claiming the Light^12^Blood Elf^Paladin^Magister Astalor Bloodsworn^Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^Summons from Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^^^Use the Shimmering Vessel on the Blood Elf Magisters to fill it and return to Knight-Lord Bloodvalor in Silvermoon City.^Take this vessel
column2: <name>. The enchantment it bears will allow you to draw the last vestiges of the Light surrounding these magisters. They once tended the captive naaru and some of its energy yet remains within them. It will be just enough to restore your comrade to life. Do not worry about the magisters
column3: <name>. I have seen to their care
column4: and Lord Solanar assures me that Lady Liadrin seeks a new source of power even now.

column1: Redeeming the Dead^12^Blood Elf^Paladin^Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^Summons from Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^^^Take the Filled Shimmering Vessel to Silvermoon City's inn and use its magic to resurrect Sangrias Stillblade.^While you were preparing the vessel
column2: I sent a group of initiates to retrieve Sangrias Stillblade. You will find him on the top level of Silvermoon's inn with an attendant. Make your way there with all haste and unleash the vessel's magic to restore him to life. Time is of the essence
column3: <name>. Once he has been dead for too long
column4: not even the Light can bring him back to us. Return to me once you have resurrected Stillblade.

column1: The Second Trial^20^Blood Elf^Paladin^Master Kelerun Bloodmourn^Master Kelerun Bloodmourn^The Second Trial^^^Complete the Second Trial by defeating Champion Bloodwrath
column2: Champion Lightrend
column3: Champion Swiftblade
column4: and Champion Sunstriker in the pavilion near Master Kelerun Bloodmourn.^You stand on the verge of adept status in the order
column5: <name>. First
column6: you must prove your worthiness by undertaking another trial. The Second Trial differs from the first in that there will be no surprises this time. The challenge before you is simple; you must face and best four Blood Knight champions in combat. When you accept the challenge
column7: a crystal will appear in the middle of the pavilion. Touch it to begin your trial and do not stray far from the building. Are you prepared?

column1: Restoring Sanctity^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Prince Toreth^Prince Toreth^^^Into the Dream^Prince Toreth on Wyrmscar Island wants you to recover 8 Dragon Bones.^Not long ago
column2: the once tranquil owlkin of the region appeared on the shores of this island. One by one they would come to steal the bones of the fallen dragons. I do not know what would cause these creatures such distress or why they would want the bones of the deceased
column3: but the spirits of the brood have grown restless due to this sacrilege. To the west
column4: across the Crimson Reach
column5: you will find Ragefeather Ridge. Venture to the owlkin encampments and recover the pilfered dragon bones.

column1: Into the Dream^19^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Prince Toreth^Prince Toreth^^Restoring Sanctity^Razormaw^Prince Toreth at Wyrmscar Island has asked that you slay 5 Viridian Whelps and 5 Viridian Broodlings.^The whelps that you see on this island are the agitated spirits of the green dragonflight. Like me
column2: they are bound to the land
column3: unable to ascend to their final resting place in the Dream. Recovering the bones of the fallen has settled them somewhat but you must take further action. Destroy their ethereal manifestations. I cannot leave this place until it is done. They must be released!

column1: Razormaw^21^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Prince Toreth^Prince Toreth^^Into the Dream^^Prince Toreth at Wyrmscar Island has asked that you slay Razormaw.^Many of the black dragonflight were slain during the attacks. One of them
column2: a lieutenant of Deathwing himself
column3: still haunts this place. If you look to the heavens
column4: you can see his spectral countenance circling the skies. His hatred is so great that he remains even in death. Take the bones that you gathered for me earlier to the top of the mountain on this island and place them in the ever-burning pyre. This act should signal Razormaw to descend. When he does
column5: slay his undead form.

column1: The Second Trial^20^Blood Elf^Paladin^Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^Master Kelerun Bloodmourn^The Second Trial^^^Report to Master Kelerun Bloodmourn.^Initiate <name>
column2: you have worked hard to master the powers of the Light won by our magisters. You have learned the source of our abilities and of the duties of a Blood Knight. The time has come for you to undergo the Second Trial
column3: and contest for status as an adept among the Blood Knights. The trial will be administered by Master Kelerun Bloodmourn at a location north of the city. Travel north through the Ruins of Silvermoon and take the east path immediately before the bridge to Sunstrider Isle.

column1: Return to Silvermoon^20^Blood Elf^Paladin^Master Kelerun Bloodmourn^Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^The Second Trial^^^Return to Knight-Lord Bloodvalor in Silvermoon City.^Return to Silvermoon City and report to Knight-Lord Bloodvalor promptly. Your arrival will tell him all he needs to know about the outcome of the trial. He will tell you of your remaining tasks on the road to becoming an adept. Hold your head high
column2: <name>. Many undertake this trial
column3: but very few return to tell of their success.

column1: The Path of the Adept^23^Blood Elf^Paladin^Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^The Second Trial^^^Bring a Corrupted Kor Gem
column2: a Crate of Bloodforged Ingots
column3: a quantity of Blood of the Wrathful
column4: and a Blood Knight Insignia to Knight-Lord Bloodvalor in Silvermoon City.^Before a newly-minted adept can be accepted into the ranks of the Blood Knights
column5: <he/she> must procure the resources to create our order's distinctive weapon
column6: the blood-tempered ranseur. You must also earn the right to wear our order's insignia. When the order was founded
column7: a set number were forged and distributed
column8: so each new adept inherits <his/hers> from a veteran. Your insignia will come from a fallen knight who bravely led an assault on Deatholme. I have prepared a set of notes to guide you.

column1: What Argus Means to Me^15^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Exarch Admetius^Vindicator Boros^What Argus Means to Me^^^Exarch Admetius at Blood Watch has told you to speak with Vindicator Boros.^What does Argus mean to you
column2: <name>? Many draenei probably do not know or remember our home planet. It is there that we split from the man'ari: the twisted demonic reflections of ourselves that were 'gifted' by Sargeras. Or as they call themselves
column3: eredar. Eredar... this word once held meaning. <Admetius smacks his lips as if to taste the word.> Disgusting. Let us not waste anymore time. Find Vindicator Boros to begin your training.

column1: Blood Watch^15^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Vindicator Boros^Vindicator Boros^What Argus Means to Me^^Intercepting the Message^Vindicator Boros at Blood Watch wants you to slay 10 Sunhawk Spies.^Blood Watch is one of two forward bases operated by the Hand of Argus. You have already been to the other base
column2: Azure Watch; things are completely different in Bloodmyst. When we first got here
column3: the land was as beautiful as Azuremyst. We even called it Silvergale but now sickness is spreading across the land
column4: worse yet
column5: the blood elves that we were battling on the Exodar survived the crash. This brings me to your assignment: Venture northwest into Bladewood and terminate any blood elves that you find.

column1: Translations...^16^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Vindicator Boros^Interrogator Elysia^The Sun King's Command^^^Take the Sunhawk Missive to Interrogator Elysia at Blood Watch.^Our chief interrogator
column2: Elysia
column3: is fluent in Thalassian. Take the document to her and see what she has to say.

column1: Watcher Leesa'oh^63^All^Zangarmarsh^Lethyn Moonfire^Watcher Leesa'oh^Watcher Leesa'oh^^^Speak with Watcher Leesa'oh at the Cenarion Watchpost in Zangarmarsh.^There's important research to be conducted into the ecology of the local creatures
column2: especially the sporelings and bog lords of the marsh. And trust me
column3: once you get out into the field
column4: you'll find the work to be challenging. Seek out Watcher Leesa'oh at the Cenarion Watchpost in the western region of the marsh toward the south. Follow the path west and you will eventually find her. She can be a bit -- studious -- but don't let that get to you. Oh
column5: and watch out for her cat.

column1: Audience with the Prophet^16^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Interrogator Elysia^Prophet Velen^The Sun King's Command^^^Take the Translated Sunhawk Missive to Prophet Velen at the Exodar.^I need you to deliver the translated documents to Velen personally
column2: <name>. I don't trust that deranged messenger. Explain to the Prophet that the blood elves are receiving reinforcements from the Outland and that they have a spy amongst the draenei at the Exodar. Velen resides in the Vault of Lights inside the Exodar. Make haste!

column1: Truth or Fiction^16^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Prophet Velen^Vindicator Boros^The Sun King's Command^^^Take Velen's Orders to Vindicator Boros at Blood Watch.^I thank you for the timely delivery
column2: <name>. You are turning out to be one of the Hand's better agents. If only we knew who they reported to in Bloodmyst and more importantly
column3: where this sun portal was... They seem to have it tightly guarded - wherever it may be. Would you be interested in some reconnaissance work? If so
column4: take these orders back to Vindicator Boros. He will give you your next mission.

column1: I Shoot Magic Into the Darkness^16^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Vindicator Boros^Vindicator Boros^The Sun King's Command^^The Cryo-Core^Vindicator Boros at Blood Watch wants you to locate the Sun Portal Site and slay 5 Void Anomalies.^Velen states that if the blood elves have been opening rifts between this island and the Outland
column2: there will be residue or anomalies left in the areas where the portals have been opened. You must search the island for locations that exhibit or display these anomalies. Be warned
column3: <name>; some of these anomalies will be creatures from the void itself. Should you find void anomalies
column4: slay them! Report back to me with any new information that you may find. Begin your search to the north
column5: near the Warp Piston.

column1: Observing the Sporelings^63^All^Zangarmarsh^Watcher Leesa'oh^Watcher Leesa'oh^Watcher Leesa'oh^^^Investigate the Spawning Glen in Zangarmarsh
column2: and then report back to Watcher Leesa'oh at the Cenarion Watchpost in Zangarmarsh with your findings.^We need to learn all that we can of the sporelings at Sporeggar and their relationship to the creatures around them. One way to do that is what I'm doing; passive observation while making a note of their interactions. I need you to head over to the Spawning Glen to the west. Investigate the whole area and then return to tell me what you saw.

column1: A Question of Gluttony^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Watcher Leesa'oh^Watcher Leesa'oh^Watcher Leesa'oh^^^Collect 10 pieces of Discarded Nutriment and then return to Watcher Leesa'oh at the Cenarion Watchpost in Zangarmarsh.^I was wondering why the bog lords were crossing the road to go to the Spawning Glen - they must be starving for some reason. This just will not do! I mean
column2: normally I wouldn't get involved
column3: but if they continue to eat all of the sporeling pods they'll wipe them out! Here's what we'll do: I'll stay here and you head to the Quagg Ridge to the east and look for dietary clues as to why they're raiding the sporelings.

column1: The Cryo-Core^17^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Vindicator Kuros^Vindicator Kuros^^I Shoot Magic Into the Darkness^Don't Drink the Water^Vindicator Kuros at Blood Watch wants you to recover 12 boxes of Medical Supplies.^We have others pursuing leads on the sun portals
column2: <name>. I need you to focus on the task at hand. Boros has received new reports of another crash site. What we've since discovered is that the crash site is actually the Exodar's cryo-core. This is a pod holding area that houses pods exactly like the ones we draenei crawled out of in Ammen Vale. This area also holds medical supplies. Head to the Cryo-Core
column3: directly west of Blood Watch. Search for supplies and search for survivors.

column1: Slain by the Wretched^5^Horde^Eversong Woods^Outrunner Alarion^Slain Outrunner^Aiding the Outrunners^^^Go south into the ruins of Silvermoon and look for the Slain Outrunner in Dawning Lane.^It's hard work being an outrunner between Sunstrider Isle and Falconwing Square. Tight deadlines
column2: long hours and worst of all... the Wretched! The road south goes through the ruins of Silvermoon... the place is crawling with Wretched ready to kill you for a few mana crystals. Unfortunately
column3: I think that's what happened to the last outrunner we sent with one of Erona's packages. I see you're eager to prove yourself. Venture into Dawning Lane and see if you can find any traces of our outrunner.

column1: Package Recovery^5^Horde^Eversong Woods^Slain Outrunner^Outrunner Alarion^Aiding the Outrunners^^Completing the Delivery^Return to Outrunner Alarion with Erona's Package.^You take the package and confirm that indeed it comes from Magistrix Erona. Alarion would probably want you to bring it to her.

Galaen's Journal - The Fate of Vindicator Saruan^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Galaen's Journal^Vindicator Kuros^^Searching for Galaen^Matis the Cruel^Take Galaen's Journal to Vindicator Kuros at Blood Watch.^Your hands tremble as you pick up the book. Kuros must be told about this tragedy. Return the book to him.
Forging the Weapon^23^Blood Elf^Paladin^Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^Bemarrin^The Second Trial^^^Take the Crate of Materials to Bemarrin in Silvermoon City.^Once again
column2: you have proven yourself worthy before the order and your peers. It is with great pleasure that I bestow upon you the rank of adept
column3: <name>. Prince Kael'thas himself would be proud of you. Any of us would be honored to fight by your side on the field of battle. Continue to serve as an example for those who aspire to join us. Show neither mercy nor weakness
column4: defend your people and your brothers tirelessly
column5: and hone your mastery of the Light. Now
column6: claim the weapon befitting your new rank.

column1: Familiar Fungi^63^All^Zangarmarsh^Watcher Leesa'oh^Watcher Leesa'oh^Watcher Leesa'oh^^^Collect 15 Mushroom Samples and return them to Watcher Leesa'oh at the Cenarion Watchpost in Zangarmarsh.^Yes
column2: that's it
column3: I knew I had seen this particular phylum of mushroom elsewhere in the marsh! To the north is a place known as the Hewn Bog. Odd name for the place if you ask me
column4: but I've never been there. I'll need samples of those mushrooms to confirm my hypothesis. Just be careful
column5: <class>. I'd heard that ogres have moved in to the area
column6: so you'll have to get the samples from them. Could that be why the bog lords are no longer going there for their food?

column1: Stealing Back the Mushrooms^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Watcher Leesa'oh^Watcher Leesa'oh^Watcher Leesa'oh^^^Collect 10 Boxes of Mushrooms and return them to Watcher Leesa'oh at the Cenarion Watchpost in Zangarmarsh.^<class>
column2: I've got an idea. I want you to head north again
column3: this time into the heart of ogre territory! Northwest of the Hewn Bog there is a place named Ango'rosh Stronghold
column4: which sits on a floating island across a large mushroom bridge. The ogres must be storing the harvested mushrooms there. I bet you'll find them all over the place
column5: and probably on the ogres themselves
column6: too! Bring me a sufficient number and I will try to do something about providing the bog lords with a new source of nourishment.

column1: The Blood-Tempered Ranseur^23^Blood Elf^Paladin^Bemarrin^Bemarrin^The Second Trial^^^Wait while Bemarrin forges your weapon.^I've got everything prepared
column2: <name>. Very soon you will have a weapon befitting your new status.

column1: Matis the Cruel^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Vindicator Kuros^Vindicator Kuros^^Galaen's Journal - The Fate of Vindicato^^Vindicator Kuros at Blood Watch wants you to capture Matis the Cruel.^Matis will be brought to justice
column2: <name>; and I want you to be the one to find him and bring him back to the Triumvirate. Scour the island for this killer. Should you find him
column3: use this flare gun. When my trackers see the flare
column4: they'll come and assist in capturing Matis. Return to me after he's been captured.

column1: Bring Me A Shrubbery!^65^All^The Underbog^Gzhun'tt^Gzhun'tt^^^Bring Me Another Shrubbery!^Collect 5 Sanguine Hibiscus and return them to Gzhun'tt at Sporeggar in Zangarmarsh.^We must replenish our supply of sanguine hibiscus
column2: which we use for a number of purposes. They used to grow thick as shrubs
column3: but the lowering of the marsh's water levels means that they can only be found now in the Underbog at Coilfang Reservoir
column4: under Serpent Lake. It is said that the shamblers
column5: bog giants
column6: and underbats there consider them a delicacy. So
column7: if you are to help us
column8: you must retrieve the flowers from them.

column1: Disturbance at Umbrafen Lake^63^All^Zangarmarsh^Ysiel Windsinger^Ysiel Windsinger^Disturbance at Umbrafen Lake^^^Investigate the cause of the water depletion at Umbrafen Lake. Then return to Ysiel Windsinger at the Cenarion Refuge in Zangarmarsh.^We came to Outland expecting to find small pockets of life. What we discovered in Zangarmarsh was a lush environment with a thriving ecosystem. Our initial assessment of the area was deceiving
column2: however. The water levels at the lakes and marshes have consistently been going down since we started taking measurements. The impact this could have on the local animal and plant life is disastrous. Go to Umbrafen Lake
column3: southwest of here
column4: and look for clues related to this water depletion.

column1: Oh
column2: It's On!^65^All^The Underbog^T'shu^T'shu^^^^Gather an Underspore Frond and return it to T'shu at Sporeggar in Zangarmarsh.^While we are a peaceful people
column3: we are at war with the spore giants
column4: whether we like it or not. And there is a saying amongst us that all is fair in mushrooms and war! One of the leaders of the spore giants
column5: Hungerfen
column6: has been tending a very special plant
column7: known as the Underspore
column8: to perfection for millennia. It would break his spirit if something were to happen to that plant. Travel to the Underbog in Coilfang Reservoir and steal a frond off of it for us. Trust me
column9: he'll notice.

column1: As the Crow Flies^63^All^Zangarmarsh^Ysiel Windsinger^Ysiel Windsinger^Disturbance at Umbrafen Lake^^^Ysiel Windsinger wants you to use the Stormcrow Amulet to explore the major lakes in Zangarmarsh.^We must determine how widespread the naga's activity truly is and react accordingly. Exploring each body of water in Zangarmarsh could be a lengthy undertaking. If you allow me to
column2: I will use my magic to mold your shape to one more suited to scouting the marsh. Hold this amulet above the balcony near me when you're ready to begin. I will guide your way back to safety after we're done.

column1: Stalk the Stalker^65^All^The Underbog^Khn'nix^Khn'nix^^^^Bring the Brain of the Black Stalker to Khn'nix at Sporeggar in Zangarmarsh.^Historically the greatest danger to my people has been from the marsh walkers. With the new problems we are facing from spore giants
column2: we cannot afford another attack from our ancient enemies. You have proven yourself to be capable
column3: <class>. Do you think that you'd be able to journey to the Underbog in Coilfang Reservoir and eliminate the great mother of the marsh walkers
column4: known as The Black Stalker?! Bring me her brain as proof.

column1: Balance Must Be Preserved^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Ysiel Windsinger^Ysiel Windsinger^Disturbance at Umbrafen Lake^^^Ysiel Windsinger wants you to use the Ironvine Seeds on the Steam Pump Controls at Serpent Lake
column2: Umbrafen Lake
column3: Marshlight Lake and the Lagoon. Then return to her at the Cenarion Refuge in Zangarmarsh with any leftover seeds you have.^I cannot begin to comprehend why the naga would drain the water out of their own habitat. What I do understand is a need to put a stop to their operations. These seeds carry with them the rage of the earth. Take them to the steam pumps operated by the naga and use them on their controls. The vines that grow from the seeds will be as thick as your arm and as strong as iron. Go
column4: <name>. Restore the balance that the naga have upset.

column1: A Summons from Lord Solanar^60^Blood Elf^Paladin^Knight-Lord Bloodvalor^Lord Solanar Bloodwrath^A Summons from Lord Solanar^^^Speak with Lord Solanar Bloodwrath in Silvermoon City.^Your dedication to our order and advancement through the ranks has not gone unnoticed. In fact
column2: Lord Solanar Bloodwrath
column3: Lady Liadrin's right hand and a hero in his own right
column4: has asked to speak with you. This is a rare honor
column5: <name>. Normally
column6: Lord Solanar leaves the management of the order's rank-and-file to me
column7: but he has taken a personal interest in you. Do not tarry
column8: <name>.

column1: The Master's Path^60^Blood Elf^Paladin^Lord Solanar Bloodwrath^Lord Solanar Bloodwrath^A Summons from Lord Solanar^^^Speak with Lord Solanar Bloodwrath again to accept his offer of sponsorship.^Within the ranks of our order
column2: there exists an inner circle of elite knights. Members of the circle represent the most dedicated
column3: skilled
column4: and trustworthy of all Blood Knights and are handpicked by the leadership. Most simply know the masters by their thalassian charger mounts. Each candidate for membership must have a sponsor within the circle and must demonstrate their dedication to the order's central tenets. I have chosen to sponsor you for standing as a Blood Knight master
column5: if this is your wish.

column1: A Gesture of Commitment^60^Blood Elf^Paladin^Lord Solanar Bloodwrath^Lord Solanar Bloodwrath^A Summons from Lord Solanar^^^Bring 40 Runecloth
column2: 6 Arcanite Bars
column3: 10 Sungrass
column4: 5 Dark Runes
column5: and 150 Gold to Lord Solanar Bloodwrath in Silvermoon City.^A Blood Knight's loyalty does not stop at the end of <his/her> blade
column6: <name>. The order asks more of its members than mere drilling and combat. A true knight contributes to all of the order's activities
column7: even the ones that may not seem glorious on the surface. This first task is neither combat intensive
column8: nor glorious
column9: but without such contributions
column10: the order would fall apart. I will give you a list of items Magister Astalor Bloodsworn's men require to keep us supplied with Light energy for our magics.

column1: Warning the Cenarion Circle^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Ysiel Windsinger^Amythiel Mistwalker^Warning the Cenarion Circle^Drain Schematics^^Speak to Amythiel Mistwalker at Cenarion Post in Hellfire Peninsula.^The Cenarion Expedition has become a large organization with a good degree of autonomy. These events are important enough that we need to warn the Cenarion Circle. Do not worry
column2: I will not ask you to travel back to Moonglade; we have emissaries as nearby as Hellfire Peninsula.

column1: A Demonstration of Loyalty^60^All^Paladin^Lord Solanar Bloodwrath^Lord Solanar Bloodwrath^A Summons from Lord Solanar^^^Lord Solanar Bloodwrath in Silvermoon City wants you to destroy 3 Scourge Meat Wagons and kill 15 Scourge Siege Engineers.^We Blood Knights are bound to defend Quel'Thalas
column2: <name>. This is a central part of your training. Our enemies are fierce and unrelenting. Silvermoon and its people remain free by our efforts and the support of our allies. I have received some disturbing reports of a renewed Scourge presence to the southeast of our border with the Eastern Plaguelands. A company of Scourge siege engineers and their equipment appear to be staging for an attack on the Ghostlands. They must not be permitted to succeed.

column1: Now That We're Friends...^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Gzhun'tt^Gzhun'tt^Now That We're Friends...^^^Kill 12 Bloodscale Slavedrivers and 6 Bloodscale Enchantresses
column2: and then return to Gzhun'tt at Sporeggar in Zangarmarsh.^The naga of the Bloodscale Enclave to the northeast have begun to kill our people. We cannot allow this to continue
column3: <class>! We suggest that you teach them a lesson as proof of our friendship.

column1: Now That We're Still Friends...^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Gzhun'tt^Gzhun'tt^Now That We're Friends...^^^Kill 12 Bloodscale Slavedrivers and 6 Bloodscale Enchantresses
column2: and then return to Gzhun'tt at Sporeggar in Zangarmarsh.^Reports have come in that the naga of the Bloodscale Enclave to the northeast continue to kill our people. We thought that you had dealt with this
column3: <class>! I suggest that you to teach them a lesson as proof of our continued friendship.

column1: A Warm Welcome^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Warden Hamoot^Warden Hamoot^Warden Hamoot^^^Warden Hamoot at the Cenarion Refuge wants you to bring him 30 Naga Claws.^While the druids from the expedition have made themselves busy studying plants and researching the lakes
column2: I've made it my business to deal with the hostiles in the area. Ever since we set foot in Zangarmarsh
column3: the naga have launched lethal attacks against us without warning. We've done our best to keep them at bay
column4: but our resources are limited. I want you to go to the various naga strongholds in Zangarmarsh and show them that we're not to be crossed. Bring me their claws as proof of your victories.

column1: Fhwoor Smash!^65^All^Zangarmarsh^Fhwoor^Gzhun'tt^^^^Escort Fhwoor into the area of the Marshlight steam pump to retrieve the Ark of Ssslith. Bring Fhwoor and the ark back safely and then report back to Gzhun'tt at Sporeggar in Zangarmarsh.^Little naga make Fhwoor angry! Sporelings good friend to Fhwoor
column2: so Fhwoor get naga ark. We go into nearby naga village. You help? Bring friends!

column1: Leader of the Darkcrest^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Wanted Poster^Warden Hamoot^^^^Slay Rajah Haghazed at the Lagoon and return to Warden Hamoot at the Cenarion Expedition in Zangarmarsh for a reward.^A bounty is hereby declared by the Cenarion Expedition on Rajah Haghazed
column2: leader of the Darkcrest naga. Haghazed was last sighted by Cenarion scouts at the Lagoon
column3: in the central southern region of Zangarmarsh. The Darkcrest have been linked to numerous attacks against the Cenarion Expedition and their leader is considered extremely dangerous. Those seeking to claim the bounty are advised to report to Warden Hamoot.

column1: Drain Schematics^63^All^Zangarmarsh^Drain Schematics^Ysiel Windsinger^^^Warning the Cenarion Circle^Search Serpent Lake for signs of a drain. Return to Ysiel Windsinger at the Cenarion Refuge with news of your discovery.^The schematics you've obtained show an underground system of drains and pumps that connect the lakes in the region to Serpent Lake. If the schematics are correct
column2: there is a giant drain in the center of Serpent Lake. Confirm this and bring the news to Cenarion Refuge.

column1: Return to the Marsh^63^All^Zangarmarsh^Amythiel Mistwalker^Ysiel Windsinger^Warning the Cenarion Circle^^Failed Incursion^Return to Ysiel Windsinger at the Cenarion Refuge in Zangarmarsh.^Return to Ysiel and let her know that help will be extended to her as soon as it is possible. Affairs in Moonglade and Silithus have kept our members occupied
column2: but we will do our best to send the necessary resources to the Cenarion Refuge.

column1: True Masters of the Light^60^Blood Elf^Paladin^Lord Solanar Bloodwrath^Lord Solanar Bloodwrath^A Summons from Lord Solanar^^^Lord Solanar Bloodwrath in Silvermoon City wants you to bring him a vial of Tyr's Hand Holy Water.^A Blood Knight master possesses incredible skill at wielding and weaving the Light in a way that other so-called 'paladins' can never comprehend. It doesn't stop them from despising us for unleashing the Light's true potential. We must send them a message and show them that we are not to be trifled with. What I have in mind will be neither brief nor easy
column2: but if you are committed
column3: the first step will be to infiltrate the library wing of the Tyr's Hand Abbey and procure a vial of Tyr's Hand holy water.

column1: True Masters of the Light^60^Blood Elf^Paladin^Lord Solanar Bloodwrath^Lord Solanar Bloodwrath^A Summons from Lord Solanar^^^Lord Solanar Bloodwrath in Silvermoon City wants you to bring him 1 Arcane Catalyst
column2: 1 Crepuscular Powder
column3: 1 Azerothian Diamond
column4: and 1 Pristine Black Diamond.^Now that we have the water
column5: we're going to need a number of reagents in precise quantities. Some of these substances are rare and expensive
column6: <name>
column7: but I have located sources for two. You should be able to purchase some arcane catalyst from Zalle
column8: the reagent vendor in one of the shops on the plaza near the Dead Scar. Darlia
column9: the poison merchant near the rogue trainers on Murder Row
column10: stocks crepuscular powder. To complete my mixture
column11: I'll also need an azerothian diamond and a pristine black diamond.

column1: True Masters of the Light^60^Blood Elf^Paladin^Lord Solanar Bloodwrath^Lord Solanar Bloodwrath^A Summons from Lord Solanar^^^Use the Extinguishing Mixture near the eternal flame in the Alonsus Chapel to remove the Light's protection. Be prepared to fight anyone who may attempt to defend the chapel.^Ours is the true way of utilizing the Light
column2: <name>. To show others that would call themselves 'paladins' the folly of their ways
column3: I intend to send an unmistakable message. The Alonsus Chapel
column4: where the Order of the Silver Hand was founded
column5: seems immune to the destruction of Stratholme. The chapel's eternal flame affords it the Light's protection
column6: but when you use this mixture to extinguish the flame
column7: that protection will be no more. It will burn
column8: and our dominion over the Light will be proven to the world.

column1: Lost in Action^65^All^Coilfang Reservoir^Watcher Jhang^Watcher Jhang^^Failed Incursion^^Discover what happened to Earthbinder Rayge
column2: Naturalist Bite
column3: Weeder Greenthumb
column4: and Windcaller Claw. Then
column5: return to Watcher Jhang at Coilfang Reservoir in Zangarmarsh.^You have to help me! We were sent here by Ysiel to investigate the mystery of the steam pumps and why they're being used to drain the water from the marsh. But my friends split up and went on recklessly without me. Those four can be such jerks sometimes
column6: but I love them anyway. That is why I need you to discover what became of them
column7: though I fear the worst. Seek them in both the Slave Pens and the Underbog. Thank you
column8: <class>.

column1: The Sporelings' Plight^63^All^Zangarmarsh^Fahssn^Fahssn^^^More Spore Sacs^Fahssn at the Spawning Glen wants you to collect 10 Mature Spore Sacs.^You there! You must help us! The fungal giants are devouring all of our spore sacs! You must do something
column2: or we'll lose our young! The spore sacs start out large and become smaller as the air inside them is depleted. Look for the small
column3: mature spore sacs and save as many of them as you can!

column1: The Sun Gate^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Vindicator Aesom^Vindicator Aesom^Don't Drink the Water^^What We Know...^Vindicator Aesom at Blood Watch wants you to destroy the Sun Gate.^Thanks to you and the work you did
column2: my scouts were able to find the sun gate. The elves keep the portal location mobile so that they can move it at a moment's notice. That's why the site you investigated was empty. The strength of such a system is also its greatest weakness. The sun gate is stabilized by portal controllers. If we can take down the controllers
column3: the portal will be ours to destroy. The current sun gate location can be found west of here
column4: south of the Vector Coil. Find it and destroy it!

column1: Critters of the Void^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Scout Loryi^Vindicator Aesom^^^^Kill 12 Void Critters and report to Vindicator Aesom at Blood Watch.^Aesom sent my squad out on a reconnaissance mission to search for the sun gate a few days ago. Needless to say
column2: we found it... <Loryi points at Jorli.> Whatever those fool elves are transporting through that portal is causing void energy to be released. The area is teaming with void critters. We must destroy them before they have a chance to grow into void anomalies. You'll find the source of the creatures southwest of here
column3: near the sun gate. Kill them and report back to Aesom when you're done.

column1: Natural Enemies^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Fahssn^Fahssn^^^More Tendrils!^Fahssn at the Spawning Glen in Zangarmarsh wants you to bring him 6 Bog Lord Tendrils.^Us sporelings and the bog lords have never gotten along well. In the past
column2: we've managed to keep them at bay with spears and stones. Lately they seem to have become more aggressive... or more desperate. They do not fear us or our weapons. You are much scarier and better armed than us. If you were to fight the boglords for us
column3: we'd be forever in your debt! Bring me their tendrils so I know how many you've killed.

column1: Limits of Physical Exhaustion^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Vindicator Aesom^Vindicator Aesom^Don't Drink the Water^^^Vindicator Aesom at Blood Watch wants you to slay 10 Sunhawk Pyromancers and 10 Sunhawk Defenders.^Victory is close at hand
column2: <name>. With the discovery of the sun gate
column3: it won't be long until their supply lines are completely closed off. Now is the time to strike at their numbers. To the west you will find numerous Sunhawk camps. The Sunhawk pyromancers and defenders occupy the vast majority of the area. Find them
column4: kill them and return to me.

column1: The Umbrafen Tribe^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Ikeyen^Ikeyen^The Umbrafen Tribe^^Safeguarding the Watchers
column2: Saving the Sporeloks^Ikeyen at the Cenarion Refuge wants you to travel to Umbrafen Village and slay Kataru
column3: 8 Umbrafen Seers
column4: 6 Umbrafen Witchdoctors and 6 Umbrafen Oracles.^The naga are terrible
column5: yes. But even more terrible are the traitor tribes of Broken and Lost Ones that helped them! The worst of all are the Lost Ones of the Umbrafen tribe; they use dark magic to trap and enslave others. They're especially cruel to escaped slaves and would slit my throat if I left the refuge even for a day. Travel to Umbrafen Village south of here and kill them and their leader
column6: Kataru. Until then I will fear for my life every single day.

column1: Don't Drink the Water^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Vindicator Aesom^Vindicator Aesom^Don't Drink the Water^The Cryo-Core^^Vindicator Aesom at Blood Watch wants you to use the Water Sample Flask to get a Bloodmyst Water Sample.^Our shaman claim that the elements of water have become greatly agitated by the pollution of the water source. We know that the Exodar's power core is lodged into the mountain to the west. It must be leaking volatile fluids into the water supply! I need you to get me more information. <Aesom points to a flask and nods.> You are to take this flask and follow the beach north until you reach the area where the rivers of Bloodmyst drain into the ocean. Take a sample from that location and return to me.

The Bloodcurse Legacy^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Admiral Odesyus^Captain Edward Hanes^The Bloodcurse Legacy^Urgent Delivery^The Bloodcursed Naga^Admiral Odesyus has asked that you find and speak with Captain Edward Hanes.^Last night
column2: Edward Hanes
column3: captain of the ship 'Lost Hope'
column4: appeared before me in my tent. The same Edward Hanes that died of scurvy 20 years ago. This apparition told me a tale that made my heart tremble. A tale that I need you to hear and a mission that I need you to accomplish. Will you do it? Will you seek out Edward on Wyrmscar Island
column5: northeast of Blood Watch?

column1: Escape from Umbrafen^63^All^Zangarmarsh^Kayra Longmane^Ysiel Windsinger^^^^Escort Kayra Longmane to the Cenarion Refuge in Zangarmarsh. Report to Ysiel Windsinger when you've completed this task.^You must help me get out of here! I was gathering herbs nearby when a handful of these little savages abducted me. I tried to fight them off
column2: but there were too many of them. Help me return to the Cenarion Refuge and away from these cruel wretches and their vile magic!

column1: What We Know...^20^Draenei^Bloodmyst Isle^Vindicator Aesom^Exarch Admetius^What We Know...^The Sun Gate^^Speak to Exarch Admetius at Blood Watch.^We've learned much of our enemies in recent days. The blood elves are led by a being known as Sironas and plot to destroy us. Ultimately
column2: they seek to enslave O'ros and regain control of the Exodar. Light be praised
column3: we have stopped their supply line by destroying the sun gate. Unfortunately
column4: they continue to use the contaminant of the Vector Coil to poison the land
column5: using the mutagenic properties of the fallout to their advantage. With this knowledge
column6: Admetius has devised a plan. Seek him out.

column1: What We Don't Know...^20^Draenei^Bloodmyst Isle^Exarch Admetius^Exarch Admetius^What We Know...^^^Speak to a Captured Sunhawk Agent at Blood Watch and recover Sunhawk Information. Return to Exarch Admetius when the task is complete.^Our attempts at interrogation have failed miserably
column2: <name>. Torture is - of course - out of the question. What we need is a draenei on the inside. I can cast a spell upon you that would make you appear blood elf and adjust your language. Through subterfuge
column3: we may be able to get the information we need out of the captured agent. Under this guise
column4: I want you to get whatever information you can out of the prisoner. And <name>
column5: do not leave Blood Watch while disguised as the spell will fail.

column1: Seek Huntress Kella Nightbow^10^Draenei^Hunter^Thorgas Grimson^Huntress Kella Nightbow^Seek Huntress Kella Nightbow^^^Speak with Huntress Kella Nightbow near Valaar's Berth.^Huntress Kella Nightbow seeks the audience of all eligible hunters. She is the one to teach you the skill of taming wild beasts
column2: a lesson you should learn above all else at this point in your training. Kella can be found near Valaar's Berth
column3: the docks west of the Exodar.

column1: Return to Arcanist Vandril^10^Horde^Ghostlands^High Executor Mavren^Arcanist Vandril^The Forsaken^^Anok'suten^Return to Arcanist Vandril at Tranquillien in the Ghostlands.^Now my friend
column2: if you would be so kind as to return to Arcanist Vandril
column3: I know that he is very anxious to send you out on your first mission here in the Ghostlands. We're counting on you
column4: <name>. Don't let us down.

column1: Ending Their World^20^Draenei^Bloodmyst Isle^Demolitionist Legoso^Exarch Admetius^^Clearing the Way^The Unwritten Prophecy^Follow and protect Demolitionist Legoso as he attempts to destroy the Vector Coil and slay Sironas. Return to Exarch Admetius at Blood Watch should you complete the mission.^Don't accept this assignment if you value your life. You see that gigantic power core jutting out of the mountain side over yonder? Whoever takes on this burden will need to fight their way through that mountain
column2: battling an army of Sunhawks while protecting me as I rig the core up for demolition. Sironas the eredar is somewhere up there as well. I won't think less of you if you just walk away
column3: <name>. But maybe you're the one - the one to destroy the Vector Coil and take down Sironas. Well
column4: are you?

column1: Vindicator's Rest^20^Draenei^Bloodmyst Isle^Exarch Admetius^Vindicator Corin^What We Know...^^^Speak with Vindicator Corin at Vindicator's Rest on Bloodmyst Isle.^I would not ask you to single-handedly bear the burden of destroying the Vector Coil and slaying Sironas
column2: <name>; however
column3: I believe that you can be of some help in clearing the way for others that might take on such a dangerous assignment. Take the road going north out of Blood Watch and follow it until you get to the fork. Once there
column4: take the left road and follow it until you see Vindicator's Rest - it will be slightly west of the road itself. Corin will be waiting for you.

column1: Clearing the Way^20^Draenei^Bloodmyst Isle^Vindicator Corin^Vindicator Corin^What We Know...^^Ending Their World^Vindicator Corin at Vindicator's Rest wants you to slay 8 Sunhawk Saboteurs and 8 Sunhawk Agents.^Only the most battle hardened
column2: noble and positively fearless of draenei will submit to Legoso's mission. The exarch will not order any agent of the Hand to take on the task of destroying the Vector Coil and dispatching Sironas. He refuses to send any draenei to their death - which is what the mission is: suicide... <Corin sighs.> My job is to soften up the Sunhawk defenses. You are to slay Sunhawks near the Vector Coil and keep the path clear for our champion - whoever that may be.

column1: The Warlord's Hideout^70^All^The Steamvault^Watcher Jhang^Watcher Jhang^^^^Watcher Jhang wants you to find and slay Warlord Kalithresh inside Coilfang Reservoir.^There are benefits to hiding very
column2: very quietly at the entrance of your enemy's hideout. Just hours ago I saw a group of naga go through the stone archway on the second tunnel from the left. I'm not well versed in their language
column3: yet I clearly understood one word: Kalithresh. That must be the entrance to the steam vaults
column4: where Warlord Kalithresh has been commanding his troops from. You must find him and stop him. I am too weak to be of any assistance.

column1: Orders from Lady Vashj^70^All^The Steamvault^Orders from Lady Vashj^Ysiel Windsinger^Orders from Lady Vashj^^^Deliver the Orders from Lady Vashj to Ysiel Windsinger at the Cenarion Refuge in Zangarmarsh.^This letter contains detailed orders to the Coilfang naga operating the steam vaults. It warns of the arrival of Cenarion druids into the region and orders them to be slain on sight. The rate of water redirection from other lakes into Coilfang Reservoir is to be doubled. The orders bear the seal of the infamous Lady Vashj. This letter would be of great interest to the druids of the Cenarion Expedition. Take it to their leader
column2: Ysiel Windsinger.

column1: Preparing for War^70^All^The Steamvault^Ysiel Windsinger^Ysiel Windsinger^Orders from Lady Vashj^^Coilfang Armaments^Obtain Coilfang Armaments from naga at Coilfang Reservoir and return them to Ysiel Windsinger at the Cenarion Refuge in Zangarmarsh.^The Cenarion Expedition began as a peaceful venture
column2: yet we now face the prospect of all out war with the naga. We have many among us who are willing to fight but are ill equipped. Bring me the naga's own weapons so that we may reforge them into glaives and arrowheads. Only the best armaments will have materials useful to us
column3: <name>. You will have to seek out the naga of Coilfang Reservoir.

column1: There's No Explanation for Fashion^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Magasha^Magasha^^^^Bring 8 Diaphanous Wings from any species of Zangarmarsh fireflies to Magasha in Swamprat Post.^<Magasha chuckles softly to herself.> I bet if they knew they were wearing bug parts
column2: the fashion trend would end very quickly. We first started killing the bugs 'round here 'cause they were getting in the way of our construction. Some enterprising merchant stops here
column3: spends the night
column4: and next thing you know he's buyin' up all the bug wings we have! Says he makes clothes out of 'em. I be stickin' to my armor
column5: thanks. But if you gather the wings of any of the fireflies
column6: I'll gladly buy 'em.

column1: Menacing Marshfangs^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Reavij^Reavij^Menacing Marshfangs^^Nothin' Says Lovin' Like a Big Stinger^Reavij at Swamprat Post wants you to kill 10 Marshfang Rippers.^Sometimes I wish Denjai had sent a shaman with us
column2: or at least given us a totem to keep the marshfang rippers at bay. The whole place is crawling with the pests! It's just not right. Shouldn't something be eating these despicable things? We've all been taking turns playing exterminator. You showed up at just the right time
column3: <name>. Congratulations! Now get out there and mop up some marshfangs!

column1: Searching for Scout Jyoba^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Zurai^Scout Jyoba^Thick Hydra Scales^^^Search for Scout Jyoba at the Dead Mire in Zangarmarsh.^Now that you're familiar with the terrain
column2: I'd like to ask your help with something else. The Dead Mire
column3: we've taken to calling the area to the northwest
column4: is an eerie place. No one has ever reported seeing anything alive there
column5: but they didn't stay for very long
column6: either. Scout Jyoba volunteered to investigate the area and report on his findings. He left the post three days ago and hasn't returned. It's not like him to be gone that long without sending some kind of report. Will you search for him
column7: <name>?

column1: Jyoba's Report^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Scout Jyoba^Zurai^Thick Hydra Scales^^^Retrieve Scout Jyoba's Report from the Withered Giants and return it to Zurai at Swamprat Post.^Flecks of withered fungus dot the body of Scout Jyoba. Whatever killed him must've been made of the same dying fungus as the giant wilting mushrooms of the Dead Mire. Perhaps one of the withered giants caught him by surprise as he sat writing his report. Without the text of the report
column2: it's nearly impossible to tell what the scout discovered. If the report can be found
column3: it should be returned to Zurai.

column1: No More Mushrooms!^61^Horde^Zangarmarsh^Magasha^Magasha^^^^Gather 8 Eel Filets from Umbrafen Eels and bring them to Magasha at Swamprat Post.^Mushroom soup
column2: mushroom stew
column3: mushroom sauce! Mushroom
column4: mushroom
column5: mushroom! It's all there is to eat around here. If you say you're hungry
column6: the cook hands you an axe and tells you to go chop down your dinner! Well
column7: I'm tired of mushrooms. I've seen fish in the lakes around here. Sure
column8: they look like a nasty piece of work
column9: but they've got to be better than mushrooms! How much will it cost me to hire you to bring me my first decent meal in weeks?

column1: Thick Hydra Scales^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Zurai^Zurai^Thick Hydra Scales^^Searching for Scout Jyoba^Zurai at Swamprat Post wants you to bring him 12 Thick Hydra Scales.^Reavij was wise to bring leather armor. This swamp will render my mail useless before long. I've been replacing the scales bit by bit as I'm able. The hydra in the marsh have thick
column2: protective scales that stand up well to the dampness of their home. Finding suitable ones is a tedious process
column3: though. All too often
column4: the best scales are torn or worn too thin for use in armor. Bring me any good ones that you might get from the hydra in the larger lakes.

column1: Report to Shadow Hunter Denjai^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Zurai^Shadow Hunter Denjai^^^^Bring Zurai's Report to Shadow Hunter Denjai at Zabra'jin in Zangarmarsh.^Shadow Hunter Denjai will no doubt expect to receive a report about my progress in establishing our outpost. I've prepared a short summary of what we've accomplished here already
column2: but with the loss of Scout Jyoba
column3: I can't spare a runner to take the report to Denjai's base of Zabra'jin to the west. If you're headed that way
column4: would you mind bringing this to him? Shadow Hunter Denjai can be a little intimidating at first
column5: but once you get used to him
column6: he's not so bad.

column1: The Orebor Harborage^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Anchorite Ahuurn^Ikuti^^^^Speak to Ikuti at the Orebor Harborage in Zangarmarsh.^As you know
column2: many of Telredor's inhabitants are refugees from the war that decimated the draenei. It is my goal to maintain Telredor as a safe haven for all of our allies in this struggle. There are some who desire to join us
column3: but feel they are not yet ready. We owe them whatever help we can provide
column4: <name>. A group of Broken under the leadership of Ikuti have taken shelter in the ruins of an old temple to the northwest of Serpent Lake. Seek them out and extend your hand in friendship to them.

column1: Fulgor Spores^62^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Ruam^Ruam^^^^Bring 6 Fulgor Spores to Ruam at Telredor.^There is little in this swamp that will burn
column2: <race>
column3: so we must resort to other means for lighting Telredor. Many of the creatures and plants in the marsh emit a soft glow. It's difficult and cruel to confine the glowing creatures
column4: so we've turned to a species of mushroom for our light source. We pick and cultivate the fulgor mushroom here
column5: but our needs require us to gather new crops occasionally. The small green mushrooms often grow at the base of larger ones near Telredor.

column1: Warden Hamoot^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Ysiel Windsinger^Warden Hamoot^Warden Hamoot^^^Report to Warden Hamoot at the Cenarion Refuge in Zangarmarsh.^Before you leave Cenarion Refuge
column2: make sure you speak with Warden Hamoot. He's in charge of the expedition's security. He would never forgive me if I didn't send a seasoned adventurer like you his way.

column1: Intercepting the Message^16^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Vindicator Boros^Vindicator Boros^Intercepting the Message^Blood Watch^^Kill Sunhawk elves until you find the Sunhawk Missive
column2: then return it to Vindicator Boros at Blood Watch.^It is good to see you again
column3: <name>. I have a quandary that you might be able to solve. Our agents situated behind Sunhawk lines have reported seeing Sunhawk soldiers parsing an unusual document. Unfortunately
column4: we have been unsuccessful in acquiring a copy of the document for ourselves. I need you to go out in the field and try to recover the document. I am certain that if you apply enough pressure
column5: a Sunhawk agent will turn over the information we seek. I leave the use of force to your discretion.

column1: Umbrafen Eel Filets^62^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Noraani^Noraani^Menacing Marshfangs^^^Noraani at Telredor wants you to bring her 8 Eel Filets.^It's good to see another fresh face here. When Haalrun and I first came to Telredor
column2: we were the only outsiders
column3: but that seems like a lifetime ago. Still
column4: we try to welcome newcomers and ensure that there's always enough food and supplies. We can never fully repay the kindness of the Telredor anchorites
column5: but we can follow their example and extend it to others. If you would like to help
column6: the nearby lakes are populated with a fish called the Umbrafen eel
column7: whose meat is a staple of our diet.

column1: Too Many Mouths to Feed^62^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Haalrun^Haalrun^Too Many Mouths to Feed^^Diaphanous Wings^Kill 10 Mire Hydra and return to Haalrun at Telredor.^On my last hunting trip
column2: I caught sight of a new outpost being built by a group of trolls. No doubt they've begun hunting these lands
column3: too. If they establish a permanent presence out here
column4: the competition for food will be fierce. We cannot take direct action against them without provocation
column5: but we can remove some of the natural competition for food. For each mire hydra you kill
column6: that's three fewer mouths to feed!

column1: The Dead Mire^62^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Vindicator Idaar^Vindicator Idaar^The Dead Mire^^^Bring a Dead Mire Soil Sample to Vindicator Idaar at Telredor.^I have lived among the anchorites of Telredor for some time
column2: <name>
column3: and in that time I've come to know the marsh quite well. Recently
column4: I've started to notice a disturbing change in the land to the northeast. Virtually all life there has begun to wither and die
column5: seemingly without explanation. I have a few ideas as to what might be happening
column6: but they are little more than speculation. If you were to bring me a sample of the soil in that area
column7: I may be able to get to the bottom of this mystery.

column1: An Unnatural Drought^62^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Vindicator Idaar^Vindicator Idaar^The Dead Mire^^^Vindicator Idaar at Telredor wants you to kill 12 Withered Giants.^The soil sample you brought me is nearly devoid of moisture
column2: <name>. If the soil itself is losing moisture
column3: then the creatures that live in the Dead Mire must be suffering terribly. I've seen what happens when the region's fungal giants begin to wither and die. The pain drives them mad
column4: causing them to attack anything in their path. These creatures have no idea what's happening to them. They're beyond our ability to save
column5: so the best we can do is to end their suffering.

column1: Blessings of the Ancients^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Windcaller Blackhoof^Windcaller Blackhoof^^^^Windcaller Blackhoof wants you to speak to the ancients Ashyen and Keleth at Cenarion Refuge and obtain their blessings.^You've earned the trust of the Cenarion Expedition
column2: <name>. It is time you spoke to the ancients allied with our cause
column3: Ashyen and Keleth
column4: and asked for their blessing. Carrying the mark of an ancient will fill you with great power. These boons will become more powerful as your renown among us increases. Go
column5: <name>
column6: and ask the ancients for their blessing.

column1: The Boha'mu Ruins^62^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Anchorite Ahuurn^Anchorite Ahuurn^The Boha'mu Ruins^^^Anchorite Ahuurn at Telredor wants you to explore the Boha'mu Ruins.^Before my people were decimated by the orcs
column2: Telredor served as a retreat for draenei anchorites and spiritualists. A small order of anchorites and vindicators maintained a number of shrines in this region. During the war
column3: we lost contact with the anchorites assigned to the shrines
column4: particularly the Boha'mu temple to the southwest. I've heard reports that a tribe of Lost Ones has settled in the area and may even be using the ruins. Visit the Boha'mu Ruins and tell me of what you find there.

column1: Idols of the Feralfen^62^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Anchorite Ahuurn^Anchorite Ahuurn^The Boha'mu Ruins^^^Gather 6 Feralfen Idols and return them to Anchorite Ahuurn at Telredor.^From what you've told me about your observations at the Boha'mu Ruins
column2: it seems this tribe of Lost Ones has reverted to the worship of animal spirits. Before we can approach them
column3: we must know more of their beliefs. Return to Feralfen Village and discreetly gather some of their idols so that I may study them. Try to avoid angering them
column4: <name>
column5: as it may hurt our chances of making contact with them.

column1: A Damp
column2: Dark Place^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Ikeyen^Ikeyen^The Umbrafen Tribe^^^Look for Ikeyen's Belongings inside a cave south of Umbrafen. Return them to Ikeyen at Cenarion Refuge in Zangarmarsh.^Soon after I escaped the Umbrafen tribe
column3: I holed up in a cave south of their village. Little did I know that the cave was being fought over by marsh beasts and spore men! I had to leave in a hurry and left behind a box containing my only worldly possessions. After managing to sneak out of Umbrafen with my belongings it was terrible irony that I would lose them so soon after. If you're willing to bring them back to me I'll give you one of my very own personal items. What do you say
column4: <name>?

column1: Clefthoof Mastery^66^All^Nagrand^Hemet Nesingwary^Hemet Nesingwary^Clefthoof Mastery^^^Hunt down 12 Clefthoof and return to Hemet Nesingwary at Nesingwary's Safari in Nagrand to prove yourself.^You want to earn a place in this safari? You'll have to prove yourself. I don't care what you've hunted before
column2: you haven't hunted until you hunt what we hunt here. Start with the clefthoof if you're <man /tough> enough. I know that I've seen them in the immediate area around the safari and also close by to the south.

column1: Diaphanous Wings^62^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Haalrun^Haalrun^Too Many Mouths to Feed^^^Haalrun at Telredor wants you to bring him 8 Diaphanous Wings from any of the firefly species in Zangarmarsh.^Living in such a remote location has taught us to make use of everything available. Of course
column2: you have to learn to stop thinking about where some of these materials come from first. I've found that the wings of the umbraglow stingers are very helpful for waterproofing. They're strong
column3: thin
column4: and flexible. <Haalrun chuckles.> I see the look on your face. Like I said
column5: it takes time to get used to the idea. If you're going to be out and about
column6: would you mind bringing me some of the wings?

column1: Menacing Marshfangs^62^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Noraani^Noraani^Menacing Marshfangs^^^Kill 10 Marshfang Rippers and return to Noraani at Telredor.^During the orcs' war against my people
column2: gatherers rarely left Telredor for fear of being attacked or captured. Now
column3: we venture out more often
column4: but the marsh is no less perilous. It seems that the nether rays have grown bolder in recent months. I don't know if it has something to do with more competition for their normal prey
column5: but they've been attacking our foraging parties on a regular basis. If we can thin their ranks in the area around Telredor
column6: perhaps they would learn to leave us alone.

column1: A Message to Telaar^64^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Ikuti^Nahuud^^^^Speak with Nahuud at Telaar in Nagrand.^You've been honorable in our dealings
column2: <name>
column3: at a time when trust is hard to win among my people. A large group of my brethren have made their home in the old draenei city of Telaar in Nagrand
column4: to the south. To reach Telaar
column5: take the road south into Nagrand
column6: then continue southeast until you find yourself in the cliffs east of Oshu'gun. Anyone who has aided us
column7: as you have
column8: would be welcome among the people of Telaar. Seek out Nahuud and tell him you have earned my trust.

column1: The Fate of Tuurem^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Vindicator Idaar^Andarl^^^^Take Vindicator Idaar's Letter to Andarl at the Allerian Stronghold in Terokkar Forest.^Prophet Velen's search for allies has emboldened those draenei remaining in Outland to begin a search of their own. The Legion's war on my people drove us from our cities and temples
column2: but they have not destroyed the traces of our civilization. Tuurem
column3: my former home in the Terokkar Forest
column4: was one of the first cities overrun by the orcs. It's been too long since I've received news of its status. Take this letter to Andarl in the Allerian Stronghold within Terokkar and see what you can find out.

column1: No Time for Curiosity^65^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Timothy Daniels^Kialon Nightblade^^^^Deliver Timothy's Letter to Kialon at Sylvanaar in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^<name>
column2: I have a favor to ask of you. Normally
column3: I would do this myself
column4: but my hands are already beyond full. I have an associate named Kialon at Sylvanaar in the Blade's Edge Mountains to the north. He's expecting to hear from me in the near future
column5: although I suspect he won't like what I have to say. If you would deliver my response to him
column6: you would have my gratitude. I must insist
column7: and this is very important
column8: that you not attempt to read the letter. It is for Kialon's eyes alone.

column1: The Ogre Threat^65^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Shadow Hunter Denjai^Nekthar^^^^Travel to Thunderlord Stronghold in the Blade's Edge Mountains and speak with Nekthar.^As if the naga and their allies weren't enough
column2: the ogres are extending their reach in the marsh. They've already conquered most of the area to the northwest and there isn't much of a buffer left. For each one we kill
column3: several more take their place. I'm not sure how long we'll be able to hold Zabra'jin once they decide to attack. Make your way north into the mountains
column4: to the orcish stronghold of Thunderlord Stronghold and let Nekthar know of our plight. Any help he can spare would be most welcome.

column1: News from Zangarmarsh^62^Horde^Zangarmarsh^Zurai^Mokasa^^^^Speak with Mokasa at Stonebreaker Hold in Terokkar Forest.^Shadow Hunter Denjai isn't the only one expecting a report from me. Mokasa at Stonebreaker Hold in Terokkar is eager to hear of our progress
column2: especially since most of her messengers travel through here. She asked me to send word once Swamprat Post was completed. If you wouldn't mind delivering the news
column3: I'd be very grateful. We may be up and running
column4: but there is still much to be done. To get to Stonebreaker Hold
column5: follow the road south out of Zangarmarsh
column6: into Terokkar Forest and beyond Tuurem.

column1: Reinforcements for Garadar^64^Horde^Zangarmarsh^Messenger Gazgrigg^Captain Kroghan^^^^Speak with Captain Kroghan at Garadar in Nagrand.^<Still catching his breath
column2: the messenger gestures for you to sit.> They may not survive
column3: <race>! Get to Garadar as quickly as your legs will carry you. <In response to your blank stare
column4: the messenger elaborates.> The home of the Mag'har
column5: lies to the south
column6: in Nagrand. Take the southern road out of the marsh
column7: then turn east at the first fork and look for a large settlement on the lake. Find our commander
column8: Captain Kroghan
column9: there and offer him what assistance you can. Garadar must not fall!

column1: Blood Elf Plans^5^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Blood Elf Plans^Vindicator Aldar^^^^Take the Blood Elf Plans to Vindicator Aldar at the Crash Site in Ammen Vale.^These plans seem important. You should take them to Vindicator Aldar at the crash site.

Botanical Legwork^3^Alliance^Azuremyst Isle^Apprentice Vishael^Apprentice Vishael^^Volatile Mutations^^Gather 3 Corrupted Flowers and return them to Apprentice Vishael at the Crash Site in Ammen Vale.^The Ammen Fields to the west are the primary breeding ground of the local lasher population. With the corruption of the water table from the nearby lake
