column2: Botanist Taerix is worried that the lashers will not be able to repopulate themselves once we've cleansed the lake. Go to the Ammen Fields and pick some of the corrupted flowers for me so that I might take a look at them and see what can be done. You should be able to identify them by their uncharacteristic red petals.

column1: A Rare Bean^65^All^Nagrand^Elementalist Lo'ap^Elementalist Lo'ap^A Rare Bean^^^Elementalist Lo'ap at the Throne of the Elements in Nagrand wants you to bring him 8 Digested Caracoli.^You are ill-equipped to face the restless elements of Nagrand. Before you can help the Earthen Ring
column2: you must help yourself. To the west you will find dung heaps left behind by the wildlife of Nagrand. You must search the dung for the digested remnants of the Nagrand caracoli. From this bean I am able to make a tablet that will aid you in your battle against the restless forces of nature. Return to me when you have collected no less than two fists worth of caracoli... Ogre sized fists.

column1: Gathering the Reagents^62^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Anchorite Ahuurn^Anchorite Ahuurn^The Boha'mu Ruins^^^Anchorite Ahuurn at Telredor wants you to bring him 4 Sporebat Eyes and 4 Fen Strider Tentacles.^I have a feeling that these Lost Ones may not respond well to a draenei
column2: but would welcome an arakkoa. I can create a potion that will allow you to take on the form of an arakkoa for a short time. It requires a couple of reagents which cannot be stored and must be used within hours of being gathered. You will need to bring me a handful of sporebat eyes and some fen strider tentacles. Both species dwell in the wilderness surrounding Telredor.

column1: Plants of Zangarmarsh^63^All^Zangarmarsh^Lauranna Thar'well^Lauranna Thar'well^^^Identify Plant Parts^Bring 10 Unidentified Plant Parts to Lauranna Thar'well at the Cenarion Refuge in Zangarmarsh.^The lakes of Zangarmarsh are slowly being drained of their water. We don't quite know why
column2: but we do know that many plants species are in danger of becoming extinct. As the expedition's cataloguer
column3: it is my job to track and identify these plants so we can better understand what's happening to them. If you'd like to help
column4: bring me unidentified plant parts. They can be picked right from the ground if you're an herbalist
column5: and the indigenous creatures of the swamp may also carry plant parts on them.

column1: Messenger to the Feralfen^62^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Anchorite Ahuurn^Anchorite Ahuurn^The Boha'mu Ruins^^^Drink Ahuurn's Elixir while standing in the Boha'mu Ruins. Speak to Elder Kuruti while you are in the form of an arakkoa.^The time has come for us to embrace the Feralfen and teach them that the Light has not forsaken them. Take the potion I've prepared and carry it with you to the Boha'mu Ruins. Once you arrive at the ruins
column2: drink the potion to assume the form of one of their bird spirits. Speak with Elder Kuruti and let him know the draenei are ready to welcome his people as our long lost brothers.

column1: Agitated Spirits of Skysong^65^All^Nagrand^Elementalist Lo'ap^Elementalist Lo'ap^A Rare Bean^^^Elementalist Lo'ap at the Throne of the Elements in Nagrand wants you to destroy 8 Lake Spirits.^The disturbance in the ebb and flow of the waters of Nagrand has greatly agitated the water spirits of Skysong Lake. They have in turn begun sowing destruction throughout the waterways of the area. Watoosun of the Water has come to us in a vision and granted us permission to remedy the problem - so long as the source of the disturbance is also dealt with... We will get to the source
column2: but first you must deal with the problems immediate to the Throne. Destroy the agitated lake spirits and return to me.

column1: Blessing of Incineratus^65^All^Nagrand^Elementalist Lo'ap^Elementalist Lo'ap^A Rare Bean^^^Elementalist Lo'ap at the Throne of the Elements in Nagrand wants you to destroy the Large Hut
column2: the Western Hut
column3: the Southern Hut and the Eastern Hut at Windyreed Village.^The wretched Lost Ones
column4: heretofore banished to the swamps of Zangarmarsh
column5: are seeking to spread their filth to other parts of our world. I have sought the wisdom of the furies and gained their blessing. To stop the source
column6: we must unleash the elements upon them! I give you living fire
column7: plucked from the fiery essence of Incineratus himself. Travel to Windyreed Village
column8: southeast of here
column9: and unleash the living fire upon their huts! Let them see the fury of the elements!

column1: Fertile Spores^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Gshaff^Gshaff^^^More Fertile Spores^Gshaff wants you to gather 6 Fertile Spores from the various Zangarmarsh Spore Bats and Marsh Walkers. Return to Ghsaff at Sporeggar when you've completed this task.^Spore bats and marsh walkers accumulate fertile spores on their appendages from wandering around the tallstalk mushrooms in the marsh. As you can see
column2: we're a short people so our options for gathering these spores are limited. Seek out the spore bats and marsh walkers and gather the fertile spores. All of Sporeggar will be in your debt.

column1: Glowcap Mushrooms^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Msshi'fn^Msshi'fn^^^More Glowcaps^Bring 10 Glowcaps to Msshi'fn at Sporeggar in Zangarmarsh.^I've seen your kind use shiny round pieces of metal to trade for things that you need. We're not so different from you. We use shiny round mushrooms as our currency. Glowcap mushrooms grow everywhere in the marsh
column2: you just have to know how to pick them from the ground without wrecking them. I'll teach you how to do it
column3: if you promise to bring us some for our reserves. What do you say
column4: <name>?

column1: The Spirit Polluted^66^All^Nagrand^Elementalist Lo'ap^Elementalist Lo'ap^A Rare Bean^^^Elementalist Lo'ap at the Throne of the Elements in Nagrand wants you to destroy Watoosun's Polluted Essence and 8 Lake Surgers.^Watoosun was able to shed the stink of corruption; but in doing so
column2: created a twisted spirit essence. A spirit essence composed of the vilest corruption found amongst the elements! You will find this polluted spirit of the swamp southwest of here
column3: hidden in the depths of Lake Sunspring. Find and destroy the polluted essence of Watoosun and any corrupt offspring that it may have created.

column1: Friend of the Sin'dorei^21^Orc
column2: Undead
column3: ^Ghostlands^Magister Kaendris^Lor'themar Theron^Friend of the Sin'dorei^The Traitor's Destruction^^Take Dar'Khan's Head to Lor'themar Theron in Silvermoon City.^This is the beginning of a new chapter in blood elf history
column4: <name>. You've helped cement the bond between my race and yours
column5: <race>. Take the traitor's head to Regent Lord Lor'themar Theron in Silvermoon City. He'll be eager to hear the news.

column1: Envoy to the Horde^21^Orc
column2: Undead
column3: ^Undercity^Lor'themar Theron^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner^Friend of the Sin'dorei^^^Bring the Letter from Lor'themar Theron to Lady Sylvanas Windrunner in Undercity
column4: the Forsaken capital in Tirisfal Glades.^There were doubts about our capabilities among our potential new allies. Of what use could we be to them when perceived as unable to deal with our problems at home? This changes everything. No longer will our power be questioned. We'll be able to join the Horde as equals. Take this letter to Sylvanas
column5: ruler of the Forsaken. She's already on our side but the news of Dar'Khan's death will be music to her ears. Prepare for a long trip
column6: <name>. If all goes well she will send you to Orgrimmar.

column1: Meeting the Warchief^21^Orc
column2: Undead
column3: ^Orgrimmar^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner^Thrall^Friend of the Sin'dorei^^^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner wants you to take the Letter Sealed by Sylvanas to Thrall in Orgrimmar
column4: capital of Durotar.^I haven't lost any love for my homeland or its people
column5: as you know. I've fought tooth and nail for Silvermoon to be allowed a place beside Undercity and Orgrimmar at the negotiating table. This should silence any opposition. Take this letter to Thrall in Orgrimmar. As leader of the Horde he will have the final say on accepting the sin'dorei's pledge. I've added my own seal to the letter as a personal endorsement. Go northwest of the city and board the zeppelin bound for Durotar at the tower.

column1: Burstcap Mushrooms
column2: Mon!^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Witch Doctor Tor'gash^Witch Doctor Tor'gash^Burstcap Mushrooms
column3: Mon!^^^Bring Witch Doctor Tor'gash 6 Burstcap Mushrooms.^You like mushrooms
column4: mon? There be a powerful one here in Zangarmarsh
column5: growin' real close to Zabra'jin. You gotta be careful
column6: though
column7: mon. They be callin' it the burstcap for a reason. If you be gettin' too close without takin' the proper precautions
column8: it'll blow right up on you! Poof! Right into a cloud o' toxic spores. I been usin' them for readin' the omens
column9: but they be almost gone now.

column1: Muck Diving^66^All^Nagrand^Elementalist Lo'ap^Elementalist Lo'ap^^^^Elementalist Lo'ap at the Throne of the Elements in Nagrand wants you to retrieve 5 Muck-ridden Cores.^The most affected elements of water can be found in the Halaani Basin
column2: southwest of here
column3: beneath the abandoned city of Halaa. While some distressed elements can be destroyed without any impact upon the environment
column4: spawns of muck must be physically removed from the world once destroyed. You see
column5: muck spawns leave behind globules of tainted debris that if left untouched will spread and further contaminate the environment. Destroy these muck spawns and bring back their muck-ridden cores.

column1: Have You Ever Seen One of These?^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Witch Doctor Tor'gash^Witch Doctor Tor'gash^Burstcap Mushrooms
column2: Mon!^^^Take the Murloc Cage and place it on the flat rock near Daggerfen Village.^This marsh be missin' one thing
column3: mon! There be no murlocs here. Don't worry
column4: mon
column5: I got a plan to fix the problem. See Gargle 'n' Gurgle over there? I plan to give the gift o' murlocs to the Lost Ones! Take this cage with you to Daggerfen Village an' release 'em in the northeastern cluster of huts. Now you know I can't be riskin' Gargle 'n' Gurgle with you
column6: but I'll give you a cage full o' colorful young murlocs. Just set it on the flat rock you be findin' up there and open the door!

column1: Leader of the Bloodscale^63^All^Zangarmarsh^Wanted Poster^Warden Hamoot^^^^Slay Rajis Fyashe at Serpent Lake and return to Warden Hamoot at the Cenarion Refuge in Zangarmarsh for a reward.^A bounty is hereby declared by the Cenarion Expedition on Rajis Fyashe
column2: leader of the Bloodscale naga. The naga sorceress was last sighted at Serpent Lake
column3: in the northern region of Zangarmarsh. The Bloodscale are to be considered extremely dangerous and their leader is to be approached with extreme caution. Those seeking to claim the bounty are advised to report to Warden Hamoot at Cenarion Refuge.

column1: The Underneath^65^All^Nagrand^Elementalist Untrag^Gordawg^The Underneath^^^Communicate with Gordawg.^Something rails the underneath. It beats the ground as if to punish. *Thud* <Untrag beats his chest with his fist.> It makes this sound a hundred-thousand times. Endlessly it beats. The earth reels. It is calling out to us now. Gordawg speaks to me. Gordawg knows that something forces the elements out. Something from the underneath. Go now and speak to Gordawg. No
column2: listen to Gordawg
column3: do not speak. Hear Gordawg...

column1: The Tortured Earth^65^All^Nagrand^Gordawg^Gordawg^The Underneath^^^Gordawg at the Throne of the Elements in Nagrand has asked that you destroy 10 Tortured Earth Spirits.^Bring up the usurper. You will find him. Follow earthen path. First you put to rest tortured earth spirits. Must sleep once more. <Gordawg smashes his fist into the ground and brings up very foul smelling soil.> Must sleep! <Gordawg points southeast.> Find spirits near mountains. Near hills. Near rocks. Near earth. Put to sleep. Telaari Basin... Southeast.
WANTED: Boss Grog'ak^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Wanted Poster^Shadow Hunter Denjai^WANTED: Boss Grog'ak^^^Bring Boss Grog'ak's Head to Shadow Hunter Denjai in Zabra'jin.^Wanted - Dead or Alive: Boss Grog'ak
column2: overseer of the Ango'rosh mushroom-cutting operation. This brute and his axe-wielding cronies are responsible for chopping down the mushrooms to the north of town. Unless he is stopped
column3: he and his band will cut a path to the walls of Zabra'jin. <He/She> who presents the head of Boss Grog'ak to Shadow Hunter Denjai shall be well-rewarded.

column1: Eating Damnation^66^All^Nagrand^Gordawg^Gordawg^The Underneath^^^Gordawg at the Throne of the Elements in Nagrand has asked that you bring him 10 Enraged Crusher Cores.^<Gordawg picks up a rock and begins to chew on it.> Gordawg tastes. Gordawg knows where this earth has been. <Gordawg raises one of his massive legs and stomps the ground.> Look. See Nagrand. <Gordawg directs you to the imprint of his foot. Within the imprint you see what appears to be a perfect geological map of Nagrand
column2: marked with the locations of where you can find the elementals Gordawg wants you to destroy.> BREAK THEM! Bring Gordawg the pieces to eat. Take the map.

column1: Impending Attack^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Shadow Hunter Denjai^Shadow Hunter Denjai^WANTED: Boss Grog'ak^^Message to the Daggerfen^Bring the Ango'rosh Attack Plans to Shadow Hunter Denjai in Zabra'jin.^The position of the ogres' mushroom-cutting operation can't be an accident. I can't escape the suspicion that they're preparing for an attack on Zabra'jin. I must know for certain
column2: <name>. The ogres have another outpost to the northwest
column3: the Ango'rosh Grounds. If they're staging for an attack
column4: there will be evidence of their plans there. Go there
column5: <name> and search the camp for signs of their intentions. Return to me with anything that might be suspicious.

column1: Us or Them^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Shadow Hunter Denjai^Shadow Hunter Denjai^WANTED: Boss Grog'ak^^^Kill Overlord Gorefist
column2: 10 Ango'rosh Maulers
column3: and 10 Ango'rosh Souleaters and report back to Shadow Hunter Denjai in Zabra'jin.^In order to end the Ango'rosh threat
column4: we must kill their leader
column5: Overlord Gorefist. We'll do better than that
column6: though. We'll make an example of the overlord and his followers. Go to the Ango'rosh Stronghold and deal with our foes. The stronghold is located in a cave on a small island to the northwest of Zabra'jin. You'll see a bridge made from a fallen mushroom beyond the Ango'rosh Camp. Show no mercy
column7: <name>. They certainly wouldn't spare any of us.

column1: Arcane Disturbances^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Archmage Alturus^Archmage Alturus^^^Contact from Dalaran^Use the Violet Scrying Crystal near underground sources of water in the Master's Cellar and return to Archmage Alturus outside of Karazhan.^I'm trying to obtain an imprint of Karazhan's energy... for a personal project
column2: of course. Unfortunately
column3: I'm not getting anything up here. If I could get near an underground water source
column4: my crystal would pick up the signals much more clearly. I've heard of an underground pond as well as a well in a cellar below us. This whole place is crawling with ghosts however
column5: and venturing there would be hazardous for someone my age. What do you say; will you help an old man and perform the scrying for me?

column1: Restless Activity^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Archmage Alturus^Archmage Alturus^^^Contact from Dalaran^Bring 10 Ghostly Essences to Archmage Alturus outside of Karazhan.^As you may have noticed
column2: the outside of Karazhan is crawling with ghostly beings. The reason for their existence is unknown and unknowns bother me! Bring me their ghostly essence so that I may study their nature. Karazhan has many secrets
column3: <name>. I'm determined to uncover all of them.

column1: Contact from Dalaran^70^All^Dalaran Crater^Archmage Alturus^Archmage Cedric^Contact from Dalaran^Arcane Disturbances
column2: Restless Activity^^Bring Alturus's Report to Archmage Cedric in the outskirts of Dalaran Crater.^These signs do not bode well for us
column3: <name>. I've never been one for secrecy so I will tell you a bit about my organization
column4: the Violet Eye. We are agents of the Kirin Tor
column5: the Magus Senate of Dalaran. We were assigned to keep an eye on Karazhan and Medivh
column6: in case things got out of hand. Which they did... very quickly
column7: after Medivh disappeared. This report details my findings. Take it to Archmage Cedric
column8: also from the Violet Eye; you will find him in the outskirts of Dalaran Crater.

column1: Withered Basidium^62^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Withered Basidium^Ruam^Withered Basidium^^^Take the Withered Basidium to Ruam in Telredor in Zangarmarsh.^A close inspection of the basidium reveals a number of indentations that might have once held something. The alien mass of fungus presents something of a puzzle. It's far from healthy
column2: but you have little clue as to what function it might normally perform. Perhaps someone more familiar with the denizens of Zangarmarsh would be able to tell you more about the basidium.

column1: Withered Basidium^62^Horde^Zangarmarsh^Withered Basidium^Reavij^^^^Bring the Withered Basidium to Reavij at Swamprat Post in Zangarmarsh.^A close inspection of the basidium reveals a number of indentations that might have once held something. The alien mass of fungus presents something of a puzzle. It's far from healthy
column2: but you have little clue as to what function it might normally perform. Perhaps someone more familiar with the denizens of Zangarmarsh would be able to tell you more about the basidium.

column1: Khadgar^70^All^Shattrath City^Archmage Cedric^Khadgar^Contact from Dalaran^^^Deliver Alturus's Report to Khadgar in Shattrath City in Terokkar Forest.^Alturus's report is unsettling. We thought it was bad when Karazhan sealed itself off to the outside world. We had agents inside; we never heard from any of them again. Now this... demonic emanation. We must investigate it. The only people who can reopen Karazhan were presumed dead: Khadgar and Medivh. While we hope that the latter is indeed gone
column2: we recently learned that his apprentice
column3: Khadgar
column4: is alive and well in a place called Shattrath City. Find him and give him Alturus's report.

column1: Stinger Venom^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Puluu^Puluu^^^^Bring 6 Marshlight Bleeder Venom to Puluu at the Orebor Harborage.^When I speak to draenei
column2: I often get the sense that they consider themselves removed from their environment. Many seem to pity my brethren
column3: the Broken
column4: who they say have lost something. We Broken may have lost our inclination toward the Light
column5: but our experiences have brought us closer to the land. My people see opportunities where few draenei do. Take
column6: for example
column7: the venom of the marshlight bleeders that live to the south and west. It has a wide variety of uses from hunting to healing.

column1: Entry Into Karazhan^70^All^Shadow Labyrinth^Khadgar^Khadgar^Contact from Dalaran^^^Khadgar wants you to enter the Shadow Labyrinth at Auchindoun and retrieve the First Key Fragment from an Arcane Container hidden there.^I am deeply troubled by the news in this report
column2: <name>. Gaining entry into Karazhan will be difficult
column3: however. You see
column4: when it became apparent that I was stranded here I split the key into three fragments. I placed the keys inside enchanted containers
column5: and in turn placed those in places that were safe at the time. With the dark changes Outland has endured this no longer is the case. The first fragment is in a section of Auchindoun taken over by the Shadow Council. Return this fragment to me.

column1: The Second and Third Fragments^70^All^Shattrath City^Khadgar^Khadgar^Contact from Dalaran^^The Master's Touch^Obtain the Second Key Fragment from an Arcane Container inside Coilfang Reservoir and the Third Key Fragment from an Arcane Container inside Tempest Keep. Return to Khadgar in Shattrath City after you've completed this task.^I hid the second fragment at the bottom of Serpent Lake
column2: long before it was called that. The giant drain installed there after the naga took over has likely pulled the container into the depths of Coilfang Reservoir. The third fragment will prove the most trying
column3: as I left it inside Tempest Keep back when it was controlled by the naaru. Kael'thas now rules it and the chamber where I left it has become a prison. Bring me these remaining fragments
column4: <name>. Much depends on your success.

column1: Lines of Communication^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Puluu^Puluu^^^^Puluu at the Orebor Harborage wants you to kill 12 Marshfang Slicers.^One of the reasons Ikuti led us to Zangarmarsh was to help open the lines of communication between the draenei and the Kurenai home city of Telaar in Nagrand. In order for messengers to pass swiftly between Telaar and Telredor
column2: the roads must be secured. On our way here
column3: we were attacked repeatedly by marshfang slicers. We were able to fight them off
column4: but they would pose a formidable threat to a solitary messenger. Reducing their numbers will help ensure the safety of our messengers.

column1: Natural Armor^64^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Maktu^Maktu^Natural Armor^^^Bring 8 Fenclaw Hides to Maktu at the Orebor Harborage.^Maktu can always see a draenei approaching in his shiny armor from a mile away
column2: even in this murky swamp! Maktu wants to laugh at them
column3: but then he remembers that they have been kind to the Kurenai and he wants to teach them about how Kurenai make armor. The dark
column4: scaly hides of the fenclaw thrashers make some of the best armor Maktu has ever worn. If <name> can bring Maktu some of these hides from the fenclaw thrashers deep in Serpent Lake
column5: he'll be happy to share some of his armor.

column1: Ango'rosh Encroachment^64^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Ikuti^Ikuti^Ango'rosh Encroachment^^^Kill 10 Ango'rosh Ogres and 5 Ango'rosh Shaman and return to Ikuti at the Orebor Harborage.^The small band of Broken you see here is a mission from a larger settlement in Nagrand. The Kurenai
column2: as we call ourselves
column3: are Broken who desire to reunite with our draenei brothers. My group has come here to strengthen Kurenai ties to the draenei of Telredor. If the Ango'rosh ogres have their way
column4: this temple will not stand much longer. They have cleared the Hewn Bog of its towering mushrooms and draw ever closer to our refuge. If you would call yourself our friend
column5: aid us in fighting this enemy.

column1: The Master's Touch^70^All^Caverns of Time^Khadgar^Medivh^The Master's Touch^The Second and Third Fragments^^Go into the Caverns of Time and convince Medivh to enable your Restored Apprentice's Key.^I've put together the very key I used as an apprentice. It looks completely functional as far as keys go. In regards to opening Karazhan
column2: however
column3: this might as well be a piece of scrap metal. Without Medivh's consent
column4: the key is worthless. Yes
column5: of course I know Medivh is dead. This merely makes things difficult
column6: not impossible. There is a place in Azeroth called the Caverns of Time
column7: guarded by the bronze dragonflight. Find a way inside
column8: travel back in time and get Medivh to enable the key.

column1: Return to Khadgar^70^All^Shattrath City^Medivh^Khadgar^The Master's Touch^^^Return to Khadgar in Shattrath City and show him the Master's Key.^I seem to have memories about future events surrounding you and this key. <Medivh looks at you like he's just seen a ghost.> You have trying times ahead of you
column2: <name>. Let us hope your strength does not fail you. Regarding the key
column3: I am to hand it to Khadgar when he's sent to me. I couldn't hope for a better apprentice. I suppose you will need a key of your own. <Medivh reaches into his robe and hands you his own key.> Go on then. And best of luck
column4: <class>.

column1: The Violet Eye^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Khadgar^Archmage Alturus^The Master's Touch^^^Speak to Archmage Alturus outside Karazhan.^A great responsibility has been bestowed upon you
column2: <name>. If the signs that the Violet Eye has observed are to be trusted
column3: then you must help them. For all my disagreements with Cedric
column4: the work that men like Alturus do is still important. Beware that they do not use you
column5: however. Remember it is you who the key is bound to
column6: not them. But if the danger in Karazhan is real
column7: then it is they who are best prepared to guide you in dealing with it. Go back to Alturus and help him in any way that you can.

column1: Overlord Gorefist^64^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Ikuti^Ikuti^Ango'rosh Encroachment^^^Ikuti wants you to kill Overlord Gorefist and 10 Ango'rosh Maulers. Return to the Orebor Harborage once you have completed the task.^The centerpiece of any ogre tribe is its leader. Without leadership
column2: the Ango'rosh's organization will disappear and they'll resort to infighting to determine who will lead next. Although we've seen the ogres out and about in this area
column3: their true strength is concentrated in their Ango'rosh Stronghold to the northwest. It's located in a cave on a small island connected to the marsh by a fallen mushroom. Go there and defeat Overlord Gorefist. That should provide us with a well-deserved respite.

column1: Assessing the Situation^70^All^The Violet Eye^Archmage Alturus^Koren^The Master's Touch^^^Find Koren inside Karazhan.^Now that we've found a way back into Medivh's Tower - or rather you have - the first thing we need to do is try to get a sense of what the situation inside is. One of our agents who had managed to infiltrate Karazhan kept an encoded log of her observations. Unfortunately her death was confirmed shortly before Karazhan was shut down. Koren
column2: Karazhan's blacksmith
column3: was under our pay. Though not a member of the Violet Eye
column4: he should be able to help us find Keanna's log. Look for him inside.

column1: Stinging the Stingers^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Gambarinka^Gambarinka^Stinging the Stingers^^^Kill 8 Marshlight Bleeders and return to Gambarinka at Zabra'jin.^It's impossible to work with all this infernal buzzing! Do you hear it? I can't get it out of my head! I know exactly what's making the noise
column2: too. It's those damnable marshlight bleeders! The noise always comes from the south and west of the village. They're too big to swat
column3: crush underfoot
column4: or wave away. The only way to stop that unholy droning is to kill them. I don't care how you do it
column5: <name>
column6: just quiet them!

column1: The Sharpest Blades^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Gambarinka^Gambarinka^Stinging the Stingers^^^Bring 10 Marshfang Slicer Blades to Gambarinka at Zabra'jin.^The damp atmosphere of the marsh has taken a toll on my metal tools. It's made woodworking a lot more difficult than it ought to be
column2: so I've given up on metal blades. It turns out that the marshfang slicers living to the south and west of town grow blades that are sharper than any steel I've ever owned. They're also resistant to rust and wear. It's just a little tricky to attach them to a handle
column3: but I think I've got it figured out. I'd appreciate any blades you could bring me.

column1: Keanna's Log^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Koren^Archmage Alturus^The Master's Touch^^^Search the Guest Chambers inside Karazhan for Keanna's Log and bring it to Archmage Alturus outside Karazhan.^Who did you say you were looking for again? Keanna? I once met someone with that name. She was staying up at the guest chambers. I was supposed to keep that a secret now
column2: wasn't I? Did you say you were with the Violet Eye? No
column3: I've never heard of them. I need to return to my work now
column4: if you don't mind. <Koren seems to have forgotten about you already.>

column1: A Demonic Presence^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Archmage Alturus^Archmage Alturus^The Master's Touch^^^Archmage Alturus wants you to destroy the Demonic Presence at the top of Karazhan.^Keanna's last few entries confirm our suspicions of a demonic presence inside Karazhan. She detected the arrival of a Burning Legion agent whose location she describes as coming from the top of the tower. Her entries stop there. Karazhan is a very important place
column2: <class>. It is a portal into the nether
column3: a beacon shining into other worlds. The possible repercussions of it falling into the wrong hands are unthinkable. This demonic intrusion must be stopped. And you
column4: <name>
column5: are the only one with a key.

column1: Angling to Beat the Competition^64^Horde^Zangarmarsh^Zurjaya^Zurjaya^Angling to Beat the Competition^^Pursuing Terrorclaw^Kill 10 Fenclaw Thrashers and return to Zurjaya at Zabra'jin.^It's a relief to be in someplace with water after trekking through the wasteland of Hellfire Peninsula. I was worried there might not be any respectable fishing holes in Outland. Now I'm glad I lugged my fishing supplies along. For the most part
column2: the fishing's been good
column3: except for those no good fenclaw thrashers in Serpent Lake. Not only do they scare the fish away
column4: but they're bold enough to snap the bait right off my hook. I spend more time re-baiting the hook than I do catching anything!

column1: Spirits of the Feralfen^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Seer Janidi^Seer Janidi^Spirits of the Feralfen^^^Bring 10 Feralfen Protection Totems to Seer Janidi at Zabra'jin.^The most powerful tribe of Lost Ones in the marsh
column2: the Feralfen
column3: are said to possess powerful medicine. There may be no truth to such rumors
column4: but anything that might help me channel the spirits of this world cannot be ignored. Find the Feralfen mystics
column5: hunters and druids
column6: <name>
column7: and capture their totems. Everything I need to know should be apparent from the carvings.

column1: A Spirit Ally?^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Seer Janidi^Seer Janidi^Spirits of the Feralfen^^^Take the Feralfen Totem to the foot of the stairs at the Boha'mu Ruins and plant it in the ground. Report your findings to Seer Janidi at Zabra'jin.^We must find out how much power this Feralfen snake spirit possesses and whether it can be bent to our will. Imagine what I could do with the powers of an Outland spirit at my command! Take this totem with you and make your way to the foot of the stairs leading to the Boha'mu Ruins. Plant the totem in the ground and it should do the rest. The spirit should not be able to tell who has used the totem until it has manifested.
Secrets of the Daggerfen^64^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Timothy Daniels^Timothy Daniels^^^^Bring the Daggerfen Poison Manual and a Daggerfen Poison Vial to Timothy Daniels at the Orebor Harborage.^Bugs
column2: bugs
column3: bugs! The marsh is full of them and my companions here seem obsessed with them. Well
column4: I've had it with the bugs! Something far more intriguing has captured my interest. To the west
column5: there is a village of Lost Ones who call themselves the Daggerfen. The whole tribe consists of highly specialized assassins. I've noticed them mixing and using a particularly potent kind of poison. I'm dying to know more about the poison
column6: but that's going to require a copy of the recipe and a sample vial.

column1: Shattering the Veil^67^All^Nagrand^Gordawg^Gordawg^The Underneath^^^Gordawg at the Throne of the Elements in Nagrand has asked that you slay 30 Minions of Gurok.^<Gordawg breaks off a piece of ebon rock from his back.> You are granted a piece of the fury of the earth. Take the boulder of Gordawg and hurl it at the poison rock. Shatter their shells to discover the truth. Destroy the minions of the usurper and return to Gordawg with the name. You find the shattered elements at the edge of the world. Southwest.

Clefthoof Mastery^67^All^Nagrand^Hemet Nesingwary^Hemet Nesingwary^Clefthoof Mastery^^^Kill 12 Clefthoof Bulls and then speak to Hemet Nesingwary at Nesingwary's Safari in Nagrand about your prowess.^You've proved to me that you can find and take down a regular clefthoof
column2: but far more dangerous are the clefthoof bulls. Bag yourself twelve of those. Then you can talk to me of your hunting prowess. Look for them all along the middle region of Nagrand to the west and south.

column1: Clefthoof Mastery^67^All^Nagrand^Hemet Nesingwary^Hemet Nesingwary^Clefthoof Mastery^^The Ultimate Bloodsport^Acquire the Horn of Banthar and return it to Hemet Nesingwary at the Nesingwary Safari in Nagrand.^Banthar is the fiercest and most elusive of all the clefthoof in Outland. She's also the hairiest. It is said that she roams with her clefthoof herd in the Field of Spirits near Oshu'gun. You want to truly prove your hunting mastery? Bring me her horn!

The Ultimate Bloodsport^68^All^Nagrand^Hemet Nesingwary^Hemet Nesingwary^^Clefthoof Mastery^^Bring the Heart of Tusker to Hemet Nesingwary at Nesingwary's Safari in Nagrand.^The queen of all that dwell in Nagrand is known as Tusker. She's a giant elekk the likes of which you won't see anywhere else! You're right to be fearful of that name. Bach'lor
column2: Gutripper
column3: and Banthar are nothing when compared to her. It is said that she can be found on a huge bluff far to the southwest overlooking Oshu'gun. Bring me her massive heart if you dare. Do you want to leave a letter with me so that I can have it delivered to your next of kin in the likely event that you don't return?

column1: Gurok the Usurper^67^All^Nagrand^Gordawg^Gordawg^The Underneath^^^Gordawg at the Throne of the Elements in Nagrand has asked that you destroy Gurok the Usurper and bring back Gurok's Earthen Head.^Gurok must be summoned. You summon Gurok and you destroy. You must go to Warmaul Hill to the northwest and find where ogre worships Gurok. You put ogre skull from Warmaul ogres on Gurok's earthen brand. Only then will Gurok come. Seven skulls. If you live
column2: bring Gordawg back Gurok earthen head. Gordawg crushes head. <Gordawg bites down hard
column3: shaking the earth beneath your feet.>

column1: Windroc Mastery^65^All^Nagrand^Shado 'Fitz' Farstrider^Shado 'Fitz' Farstrider^Windroc Mastery^^^Kill 12 Windrocs and then return to Fitz at the Nesingwary Safari in Nagrand.^Do you live for the hunt as I do
column2: <class>? Do you seek the quietude that comes as you stalk your prey? Would you know what it is to honor the last heartbeats of your fallen quarry? I will help you to achieve this. Nagrand is a lush land
column3: full of life in the midst of this broken world. Bring down a handful of the windrocs and then we will speak more. You can find them in many places nearby in all directions around our camp.

column1: Windroc Mastery^67^All^Nagrand^Shado 'Fitz' Farstrider^Shado 'Fitz' Farstrider^Windroc Mastery^^^Hunt down 12 Ravenous Windrocs and then return to Fitz at the Nesingwary Safari in Nagrand.^You must always push yourself if you are to one day stalk the mightiest of prey! While you are not yet ready
column2: I will point you in the right direction. There is another breed of windroc even deadlier. Seek out the ravenous windroc to test your mettle against. You will find them in the heart of Nagrand to the west and southwest.

column1: Windroc Mastery^67^All^Nagrand^Shado 'Fitz' Farstrider^Shado 'Fitz' Farstrider^Windroc Mastery^^^Bring the Eye of Gutripper to Fitz at the Nesingwary Safari in Nagrand.^You are ready
column2: <class>. Ready to face the mother of all windrocs
column3: Gutripper! Honor demands that after hunting so many of her children that you give her the chance to defeat you! Seek her out amongst the greater windroc far to the west. Should you survive
column4: bring her eye to me.

column1: Talbuk Mastery^65^All^Nagrand^Harold Lane^Harold Lane^Talbuk Mastery^^^Kill 12 Talbuk Stags and then return to Harold Lane at the Nesingwary Safari in Nagrand.^I don't think that I'm up to the hunt today. Do you think that you might take my place? I told Hemet that I was going to see about bagging us some of those talbuk that seem to be all over the place. The stags are especially nice to hunt. You can find them congregated around the nearby trees. Think that you could take care of that for me?

Talbuk Mastery^66^All^Nagrand^Harold Lane^Harold Lane^Talbuk Mastery^^^Hunt down 12 Talbuk Thorngrazers and then return to Harold Lane at the Nesingwary Safari in Nagrand.^This darned scratch is getting the worst of me it would seem. So
column2: are you up to filling... in for me again? This time you're going to bag yourself some thorngrazers. They're tougher and wilier than the stags
column3: so keep your wits about you. Look for them... ... sheltered under the trees in the middle of Nagrand to the west and south. Go on
column4: get out there and... show Hemet what you're made of. I'll be fine.

column1: Talbuk Mastery^66^All^Nagrand^Harold Lane^Harold Lane^Talbuk Mastery^^^Obtain the Hoof of Bach'lor and return it to Harold Lane at the Nesingwary Safari in Nagrand.^<Wracking cough.> Don't worry about... me. I'll be fine. It's just a... scratch. Just the same
column2: I think you'll... ... have to fill in for me one more... ... time. You must seek out the great Bach'lor
column3: king of... the stags. It's ok if you... ... take friends along. Bring me one of his hooves...
column4: ... as confirmation. Look for him... leading his herd in the far west of Nagrand.

column1: The New Directive^70^All^Dalaran Crater^Archmage Alturus^Archmage Cedric^The Master's Touch^^^Speak to Archmage Cedric in the outskirts of Dalaran Crater.^Return to Cedric at once
column2: <name>. The aid you've given the Violet Eye will not go unrewarded. Think what you want of us and our organization
column3: <class>
column4: but gaining the favor of the archmages of Dalaran will not be something you regret.

column1: The Howling Wind^67^All^Nagrand^Howling Wind^Elementalist Morgh^The Howling Wind^^^Find someone at the Throne of the Elements that knows how to speak Kalimag and show them the Howling Wind.^This amorphous mass of elemental air is speaking to you in a language that you cannot understand. You believe the language to be the tongue of the elements: Kalimag. Perhaps someone at the Throne of the Elements could shed some insight on this unusual find.

Murkblood Corrupters^67^All^Nagrand^Elementalist Morgh^Elementalist Morgh^The Howling Wind^^^Elementalist Morgh at the Throne of the Elements in Nagrand wants you to slay 5 Murkblood Putrifiers.^Murkblood are capturing and torturing the spirits of air! Murkblood are my kin: A tribe of the Broken who serve the vile Musel'ek
column2: beast lord of Coilfang. The air spirit states that the Murkblood putrifiers are capturing other spirits of air and using them to sow chaos into the ranks of the elements. It would seem that the Murkblood have recently sacked an orc village to the southwest known as Sunspring and are using powerful elemental magic to disturb the lake. Find the putrifiers and destroy them.

column1: Vile Idolatry^66^Horde^Nagrand^Farseer Kurkush^Farseer Kurkush^^^^Farseer Kurkush at Garadar in Nagrand wants you to bring him 10 Murkblood Idols.^With our leadership in ruin
column2: we are left open to attacks from all sides. The foul Murkblood tribe could not have picked a better time to attack us! In recent days
column3: we have been subject to no less than 5 assaults from the Broken. They have even taken over our only other territorial holding in the area: Sunspring Post. We must strike and show them that we are not powerless! Strike down the vile idolaters and bring me their twisted idols of worship so that they may ride the lightning.

column1: The Missing War Party^67^Horde^Nagrand^Farseer Corhuk^Saurfang the Younger^The Missing War Party^^^Try and find the missing Garadar war party.^After the last Murkblood raid
column2: a group of younglings decided to act. We tried to stop them but the rage had taken hold. It has now been one week since we last saw our beloved younglings. Please
column3: <race>
column4: you must find them! They have just barely reached adolescence. How can they expect to defeat such savages? They took the road leading west out of town. Follow that road around and look for signs of our younglings. And <name>
column5: avoid Halaa if you value your life. It is a war-zone.

column1: Once Were Warriors^67^Horde^Nagrand^Saurfang the Younger^Saurfang the Younger^The Missing War Party^^^Kill 20 Murkblood Scavengers and 10 Murkblood Raiders.^I do not know you
column2: stranger
column3: but I ask for your help. I feel shame for this
column4: but I am only one orc. Emotions have surfaced that I have never felt. I... I seek vengeance. Blood for blood. Do your people ever feel this? I wish to pick up my axe and split my enemies in two. To swing the weapon until my arms fall lifelessly at my sides
column5: exhausted. Sunspring Post is directly south of this procession. It is there that you will find our enemies... Kill them... Kill them all...

column1: He Will Walk The Earth...^67^Horde^Nagrand^Saurfang the Younger^Farseer Corhuk^The Missing War Party^^^Deliver the news to Farseer Corhuk at Garadar.^Will you do me one last honor
column2: <name>? I do not wish to return to Garadar. I believe that my destiny lies elsewhere - that I will serve a greater purpose someday. Please
column3: return to Farseer Corhuk and tell him that I will not be returning. That I cannot return. I must walk the earth... He will understand.

column1: Murkblood Leaders...^67^All^Nagrand^Farseer Margadesh^Farseer Margadesh^^^^Farseer Margadesh at Garadar in Nagrand wants you to bring him the Head of Ortor of Murkblood.^We have lost many friends in recent weeks. For decades we have dealt with the ogres of Nagrand but now a new threat has arisen. The Broken tribe of Murkblood attacked our fishing village to the southwest
column2: Sunspring Post
column3: and managed to kill or evict all of the orcs that inhabited the town. While the others feel that the best course of action is to kill indiscriminately
column4: I know that we must destroy their leadership. I do not know who their leader is but I suspect that you will know when you find him.

column1: The Totem of Kar'dash^67^Horde^Nagrand^Mag'har Captive^Garrosh^^^A Visit With the Greatmother^Escort the Mag'har Captive out of Sunspring Post. Speak to Garrosh at Garadar if you succeed.^Thank you
column2: stranger. They would have surely killed me had it not been for you. I was kidnapped by these Murkbloods 3 nights ago during a nighttime raid on Garadar. What I have since uncovered may very well shake the foundation of the Outland: these savages seek to recover the totem of Kar'dash! We cannot allow the totem to fall into the hands of the Murkbloods! You must help me escape. And stranger
column3: if I do not make it back to Garadar
column4: you must tell Garrosh what happened here...

column1: The Throne of the Elements^66^Alliance^Nagrand^Elementalist Ioki^Elementalist Sharvak^^^^Elementalist Ioki wants you to travel to the Throne of the Elements and speak with Elementalist Sharvak.^Greetings
column2: <race>. I am Ioki
column3: elementalist of the Earthen Ring. I have come to Telaar to inform the Kurenai of the state of the elements. Could I ask a favor of you? Would you travel to the Throne of the Elements in the northern hills of Nagrand
column4: beyond Skysong Lake
column5: and tell elementalist Sharvak that I have arrived at Telaar safely? She will surely reward you for this small deed.

column1: The Throne of the Elements^66^Horde^Nagrand^Elementalist Yal'hah^Elementalist Sharvak^^^^Elementalist Yal'hah wants you to travel to the Throne of the Elements and speak with Elementalist Sharvak.^Greetings
column2: <race>. I am Yal'hah
column3: elementalist of the Earthen Ring. I have come to Garadar to inform the Mag'har of the state of the elements. Could I ask a favor of you? Would you travel to the Throne of the Elements in the northern hills of Nagrand
column4: beyond Skysong Lake
column5: and tell elementalist Sharvak that I have arrived at Garadar safely? She will surely reward you for this small deed.

column1: Murkblood Invaders^67^Alliance^Nagrand^Murkblood Invasion Plans^Arechron^Murkblood Invaders^^^Take the Murkblood Invasion Plans to Arechron at Telaar in Nagrand.^The parchment holds a crudely painted map of Nagrand. There is a big red 'X' where Telaar would be on the map. It would seem that these savages are planning an attack on the city. Take the Murkblood invasion plans to Arechron in Telaar.

Murkblood Invaders^67^Horde^Nagrand^Murkblood Invasion Plans^Garrosh^^^^Take the Murkblood Invasion Plans to Garrosh.^The parchment holds a crudely painted map of Nagrand. There is a big red 'X' where Garadar would be on the map. It would seem that these savages are planning an attack on the city. Take the Murkblood invasion plans to Garrosh in Garadar.

Ortor My Old Friend...^67^Alliance^Nagrand^Arechron^Arechron^Murkblood Invaders^^^Arechron at Telaar in Nagrand wants you to kill Ortor of Murkblood.^These invasion plans were written by someone I once knew. Ortor of Murkblood
column2: once a noble Broken
column3: versed in the way of the elements
column4: now a muck addled yes-man of Musel'ek the bog lord. The plans state that they have taken over an orc village northwest of here known as Sunspring. Travel to Sunspring Post and rid the world of Ortor of Murkblood. What you do
column5: you do for the good of us all...

column1: Stopping the Spread^67^Alliance^Nagrand^Otonbu the Sage^Otonbu the Sage^^^^Otonbu the Sage at Telaar in Nagrand wants you to use the Torch of Liquid Fire to destroy 10 Sunspring Villager corpses. Return the Torch of Liquid Fire when the task is complete.^I have just gotten word of a catastrophe of epic proportions
column2: <name>. The foul Murkblood have sacked the orc village of Sunspring Post
column3: northwest of here
column4: and murdered its residents. To make matters worse
column5: they have begun dumping the bodies into Sunspring Lake. Should those bodies rot
column6: our primary source of water in the region will be compromised. It's a gruesome task that I give you next but it must be done. Take this enchanted torch and return to Sunspring. Burn all of the rotting orc corpses...

column1: Uncatalogued Species^63^All^Zangarmarsh^Uncatalogued Species^Lauranna Thar'well^^^^Bring the Uncatalogued Species to Lauranna Thar'well at the Cenarion Refuge in Zangarmarsh.^Lauranna must've missed this particular plant. You're certain you've discovered a species not yet catalogued by Lauranna's work. You'd best show it to her to see what she makes of it.

Failed Incursion^65^All^Coilfang Reservoir^Ysiel Windsinger^Watcher Jhang^^Return to the Marsh^Lost in Action^Ysiel Windsinger wants you to look for signs of Cenarion Expedition Druids near the entrance to Coilfang Reservoir in Zangarmarsh.^I sent a small group of our druids to investigate the drain you discovered inside of Serpent Lake. They were expected to return shortly after. Needless to say
column2: they did not. You are amongst our most capable allies; I ask you to seek them and find out what became of them.

column1: A Restorative Draught^20^Horde^Ghostlands^Arcanist Janeda^Apothecary Renzithen^A Restorative Draught^War on Deatholme^^Speak to Apothecary Renzithen in Tranquillien.^The battle against the Scourge is not one without casualties. Many are slain every day yet many more meet a worse fate. It is not uncommon for the Scourge to take prisoners. Death would be preferable to what awaits them in Deatholme. They're interrogated and tortured while under the effects of horrible will-breaking poisons. Apothecary Renzithen in Tranquillien has developed a remedy; go to him and retrieve this restorative draught.

Solving the Problem^67^All^Nagrand^Poli'lukluk the Wiser^Poli'lukluk the Wiser^^^^Poli'lukluk the Wiser at Telaar in Nagrand wants you to kill 10 Murkblood Scavengers and 5 Murkblood Raiders.^The appearance of the Murkblood in Nagrand has had a profound negative impact on our environment. The elementals are all in flux which has
column2: in turn
column3: greatly disturbed the wildlife. Worse yet
column4: the razing of Sunspring Post has reignited the hatred that the orcs held for our people. While the Kurenai are a different tribe than the Murkblood
column5: all an orc sees is Broken. We must make an effort to solve this dilemma. Travel to Sunspring Post
column6: northwest of here
column7: and resolve the Murkblood problem.

column1: The Totem of Kar'dash^67^Alliance^Nagrand^Kurenai Captive^Arechron^^^^Escort the Kurenai Captive out of Sunspring Post. Speak to Arechron at Telaar if you succeed.^I would have been killed had you not come along
column2: stranger. They have already murdered so many Kurenai in their search for a lost relic. What they seek is the totem of Kar'dash. Why they think that we would know anything about this totem
column3: I cannot understand. Is a totem not an orcish implement by nature? This information must be taken back to Arechron. Perhaps he knows why Murkblood are kidnapping Kurenai and torturing them for information regarding an orcish device. Let's go before more come.

column1: Stealing from Thieves^66^All^Nagrand^Gezhe^Gezhe^^^More Crystal Fragments^Obtain 10 Oshu'gun Crystal Fragments and bring them to Gezhe at Aeris Landing in Nagrand.^Nexus Prince Haramad has ordered us to not begin work inside of Oshu'gun as it might anger a certain powerful naaru. Sort of puts a damper on our operation. I think I might've found a loophole
column2: however. You see
column3: we're not the only ethereals drawn to this colossal diamond. A thief called Gava'xi has led a band of rogue ethereals into Oshu'gun and they've begun to dislodge large fragments from it. Your job
column4: <race>
column5: is to go there and retrieve what is rightfully ours.

column1: The Impotent Leader^65^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Jorin Deadeye^Kilrath^The Impotent Leader^^^Jorin Deadeye has asked that you find and speak with Kilrath.^I have escaped certain death
column2: surviving a cowardly nighttime attack by Boulderfist ogres upon my village. But I ask you
column3: stranger: For what? <Jorin points to Garrosh.> He has refused to give us assistance. Ogres are rampaging through my town and he sits here
column4: weeping into a fire. What has become of us? What will become of us? I've sent a scout
column5: Kilrath
column6: to the village
column7: now the Bleeding Hollow Ruins. Will you find him and give him your assistance? He hides on the border of Nagrand and Terokkar.

column1: Don't Kill the Fat One^65^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Kilrath^Unkor the Ruthless^The Impotent Leader^^^Kilrath in Terokkar Forest has asked that you kill 10 Boulderfist Invaders and beat Unkor the Ruthless until he talks.^I have been watching these beasts for days. The fat one says that he is waiting for something. What he is waiting for
column2: however
column3: is a mystery. I have a plan but it is going to involve some violence on your part. You will need to kill several of his subordinates and then beat him within an inch of his life. Do this and I am certain he will tell us everything that we need to know.

column1: Success!^65^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Unkor the Ruthless^Kilrath^The Impotent Leader^^^Take the information that you beat out of Unkor back to Kilrath in Terokkar Forest.^For many years
column2: Boulderfist ruled all ogres in the Outland. The ogres were united under Krol and content with the lands that they were given. In the past few months
column3: we have lost many ogres to a new clan known as Warmaul. Warmaul has taken most of our land in Nagrand and killed many of our people. We had no choice but to take this town. We are being exterminated... Krol has gone missing and Boulderfist is in turmoil. Lantresor of the Blade rules in his absence.

column1: Because Kilrath is a Coward^65^Horde^Nagrand^Kilrath^Jorin Deadeye^The Impotent Leader^^Standards and Practices^Take the information that you beat out of Unkor to Jorin Deadeye at Garadar in Nagrand.^Take what you have learned and tell Jorin at Garadar. I can assure you that he won't be happy to know that our village was destroyed and many of our people killed because the ogres needed more space. May the ancestors watch over you... I will be hiding in the bushes if you need me for anything else.

Obsidian Warbeads^67^All^Nagrand^Gezhe^Gezhe^^^More Obsidian Warbeads^Bring 10 Obsidian Warbeads to Gezhe at Aeris Landing in Nagrand.^All this waiting around for Oshu'gun to be ready for digging is eating into our profits
column2: <name>. Fortunately
column3: I've devised an alternate source of income. The ogres of Nagrand wear warbeads made of obsidian
column4: a mineral that commands a hefty price in many other worlds. Zerid already has had to take care a few of the brutes as a matter of security. Think of the warbeads as an added bonus. Or better yet
column5: don't think about it too much and just bring them to me.

column1: Safeguarding the Watchers^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Windcaller Blackhoof^Windcaller Blackhoof^^The Umbrafen Tribe^^Kill Lord Klaq and return to Windcaller Blackhoof at the Cenarion Refuge.^In your travels
column2: you might have encountered some of the expedition's watchers. They do the majority of the field work: documenting the unique inhabitants of the marsh
column3: collecting samples
column4: and making contact with sentient species. The safety of the watchers is paramount
column5: <class>. We've had to recall the watchers we sent to explore Funggor Cavern to the south
column6: because of marshbeast attacks. Warden Hamoot believes that killing their leader
column7: Lord Klaq
column8: will bring a swift end to the attacks.

column1: The Dying Balance^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Lethyn Moonfire^Lethyn Moonfire^^^^Locate and deal with Boglash
column2: then return to Lethyn Moonfire at Cenarion Refuge.^Have you observed your surroundings closely
column3: <name>? This is an ailing landscape
column4: struggling to keep itself in balance and losing the fight. If you know where to look
column5: you can see the symptoms. Members of some species rapidly outgrow their peers and become more aggressive. A good example of this uncontrolled growth is the marshtrekker Boglash. If you wish to see it for yourself
column6: look no further than the waterways south of the refuge. Be prepared to defend yourself. The creature knows no mercy.

column1: Blacksting's Bane^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Prospector Conall^Prospector Conall^^Unfinished Business^^Bring Blacksting's Stinger to Prospector Conall at Telredor.^By Khaz'goroth's flaming navel
column2: it's hot here! I can't blame the first party for leaving
column3: but everyone knows 'twasn't the heat that drove them away. No
column4: it was Blacksting
column5: although they won't admit it. They were camped just to the south of the glowing draenei towers to the west
column6: just north of the Feralfen Village
column7: when the giant wasp appears out of nowhere and attacks! I can't wait to see the looks on their faces when I bring the creature's stinger back to Ironforge and show it to them!

column1: I'm Saved!^65^All^Nagrand^Kristen Dipswitch^Harold Lane^^^^Give the Bundle of Skins to Harold Lane at the Nesingwary Safari in Nagrand.^I don't mind sharing. I'm just glad to be saved from that creep
column2: Gankly! And I collected tons of skins from Zangarmarsh
column3: so it's no problem at all!

column1: Nothin' Says Lovin' Like a Big Stinger^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Reavij^Reavij^Menacing Marshfangs^^A Job Undone^Bring Blacksting's Stinger to Reavij at Swamprat Post.^She will be mine. Oh yes - she will be mine. Isn't Magasha the most beautiful troll you've ever seen? I have to find a way to win her heart. Sure
column2: she has her eye on Zurai
column3: but that is about to change. My foolproof plan will see to that. All I need is a way to demonstrate my superior hunting skills
column4: and that's where you come in my friend. There's a gigantic bog wasp known as Blacksting that roams the area south of the glowing draenei towers to the west. Bring me its stinger and I'll work my magic.

column1: A Job Undone^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Magasha^Magasha^^Nothin' Says Lovin' Like a Big Stinger^^Magasha at Swamprat Post wants you to kill Sporewing.^Someone needs to find a way to make Reavij come to his senses! He's ignoring his duty and instead
column2: he's devoting all his energy to getting my attention. I've tried ignoring him and telling him to stop. Nothing seems to work. Until he gets over this
column3: I'm left cleaning up after him. He was supposed to have dealt with Sporewing
column4: but I'll bet the monster is alive and well. If you have time
column5: would you mind going to the western part of the Dead Mire and killing the bat? I'll deal with Reavij in the meantime.

column1: Gava'xi^67^All^Nagrand^Zerid^Zerid^^^^Slay Gava'xi near Oshu'gun and return to Zerid at Aeris Landing in Nagrand.^The presence of rogue ethereals in this area might amuse Gezhe
column2: who sees nothing but opportunity wherever we go
column3: but it's a true threat to the security of our operations. Their leader
column4: Gava'xi
column5: is a dangerous criminal and I've made it my top priority to see to it that he is neutralized. If you're looking to make yourself useful
column6: go and take care of Gava'xi. I will see to it that you're rewarded properly.

column1: Unfinished Business^62^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Prospector Conall^Prospector Conall^^^Blacksting's Bane^Prospector Conall at Telredor wants you to kill Sporewing.^The first expedition the league sent reported encountering a gigantic spore bat they'd taken to calling Sporewing. They had to leave in a hurry
column2: so they didn't have the chance to kill him while they were here
column3: so I figured I'd finish the job for them. What's left of their report suggests that the creature can be found in the southwestern parts of the Dead Mire. I think Vindicator Idaar mentioned that it's to the northeast of Telredor.

column1: The Terror of Marshlight Lake^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Puluu^Puluu^^^^Slay Terrorclaw and return to Puluu at the Orebor Harborage.^Traveling through naga-infested lands has shown me the cruel truth about how my less fortunate brethren are treated. At Marshlight Lake
column2: to the southwest
column3: I observed a particularly malicious taskmaster playing a deadly game. He orders his slaves out to the islands in Marshlight Lake when he knows that Terrorclaw
column4: a giant bogstrok
column5: is ready to feed. I needn't describe what results. We are too few to take on the naga directly
column6: but we can deprive them of their amusement by killing their pet.

column1: The Biggest of Them All^64^Horde^Zangarmarsh^Zurjaya^Zurjaya^Angling to Beat the Competition^^^Slay Mragesh and return to Zurjaya in Zabra'jin.^You've dealt with most of the little hydra
column2: but I doubt Mragesh was impressed by your display. He's a cunning
column3: ferocious beast and he's dogged many an angler in his time. I intend to be the last one he'll ever bother. He's bound to be hiding deep in the waters of Serpent Lake
column4: to the northeast. He's a has-been; he just doesn't know it yet.

column1: Pursuing Terrorclaw^64^Horde^Zangarmarsh^Zurjaya^Zurjaya^^Angling to Beat the Competition^^Kill Terrorclaw and return to Zurjaya at Zabra'jin.^I've caught every kind of fish that lives in the marsh
column2: but there's one that eludes me. Sure
column3: I've caught eels and mudfin frenzies. But the last time I was out on one of the islands in Marshlight Lake
column4: I hooked a gigantic bogstrok that snapped my line and got away. Terrorclaw
column5: he's called
column6: and I won't rest until he's dead. He's too big for any fisherman to catch
column7: so I suppose we'll just have to kill him the old-fashioned way.

column1: Maktu's Revenge^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Maktu^Maktu^Natural Armor^^^Locate and kill Mragesh
column2: then return to Maktu at the Orebor Harborage.^Last time Maktu was out hunting hydras for hides at Serpent Lake
column3: he was attacked by the biggest hydra he's ever seen. Maktu reached for his spear
column4: but it was too late. He had just enough time to escape becoming hydra food. Who knows? Maybe next time
column5: Maktu not be so lucky. Maktu wants to be there so there won't be a next time. Will you help Maktu get his revenge on Mragesh?

column1: Message in a Battle^65^Horde^Nagrand^Jorin Deadeye^Jorin Deadeye^The Impotent Leader^^^Jorin Deadeye at Garadar in Nagrand has asked that you slay 8 Boulderfist Crushers and 8 Boulderfist Mystics.^Ogres are moved by one thing: Might. If we expose ourselves to them as being weak
column2: they will take advantage of that weakness and wipe us out. Garrosh might be ready to lie down and let the ogre dogs take our lands but I am not! I need you to deliver a message to the Boulderfist
column3: <name>. The only type of message that they are capable of understanding: Brutality. Travel to the Burning Blade Ruins
column4: southeast of here and show them the might of the Mag'har. And <name>
column5: check in with the others before leaving.

column1: An Audacious Advance^66^Horde^Nagrand^Jorin Deadeye^Jorin Deadeye^The Impotent Leader^^^Jorin Deadeye at Garadar in Nagrand has asked that you slay 10 Boulderfist Warriors and 10 Boulderfist Mages.^Directly west of here you will find the Halaani Basin. Within the basin are the twin clefts of Nagrand: Northwind and Southwind. Boulderfist shock troops use the clefts to hide their ogre mounds. I need you to track down those troops and kill all that you encounter in the name of Mag'har.

Standards and Practices^65^Horde^Nagrand^Elkay'gan the Mystic^Elkay'gan the Mystic^Standards and Practices^Because Kilrath is a Coward^^Elkay'gan the Mystic at Garadar in Nagrand wants you to use the Mag'har Battle Standard at the First Burning Blade Pyre
column2: Second Burning Blade Pyre
column3: and Third Burning Blade Pyre. Return the left-over Mag'har Battle Standards to him when you are finished.^If you're venturing into the Burning Blade Ruins
column4: I have a task for you. Take these Mag'har battle standards and place them at three distinct locations in the ogre compound. An area of high visibility is recommended. Look for the gigantic flaming pyres on the upper levels. Place a standard near the first
column5: second
column6: and third Burning Blade pyres. The standard will leave a lasting impression upon any ogres who may have missed the battle.

column1: The Count of the Marshes^64^All^Zangarmarsh^"Count" Ungula's Mandible^Watcher Leesa'oh^^^^Bring "Count" Ungula's Mandible to Watcher Leesa'oh at the Cenarion Outpost in Zangarmarsh.^This bloody mandible comes from an unbelievably large creature. The nether ray that it belonged to has to be the largest ever seen in Zangarmarsh. Judging from the condition of the mandible
column2: the count must've abandoned a diet of carrion in favor of living flesh. Surely the Cenarion Expedition would be interested in such a specimen. Watcher Leesa'oh has a small camp to the west of Quagg Ridge.

column1: The Cenarion Expedition^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Amythiel Mistwalker^Ysiel Windsinger^^^^Speak to Ysiel Windsinger at the Cenarion Refuge in Zangarmarsh.^The Cenarion Circle's main expeditionary force in Outland is known as the Cenarion Expedition. Though it began as a small venture controlled directly by the Cenarion Circle
column2: it's become a large and fairly autonomous body. The expedition's leader
column3: Ysiel Windsinger
column4: has asked us to direct volunteers to her outpost. Report to her at the Cenarion Refuge in eastern Zangarmarsh. Take the main path to the west and it will lead you directly there.

column1: The Consortium Needs You!^66^All^Nagrand^Consortium Recruiter^Gezhe^^^^Report to Gezhe at Aeris Landing in Nagrand.^My organization
column2: the Consortium
column3: is looking for a few resourceful individuals just like yourself. You'll be hard pressed to find ethereals more honest
column4: hard-working or pleasant to be around than us. All we require is loyalty
column5: dedication and a reasonable amount of moral flexibility. If you're interested
column6: speak to Gezhe
column7: our ground operations leader. You will find him at Aeris Landing
column8: north of Oshu'gun.

column1: A Head Full of Ivory^66^All^Nagrand^Shadrek^Shadrek^^^More Heads Full of Ivory^Collect 3 Pair of Ivory Tusks and return them to Shadrek at Aeris Landing in Nagrand.^Ivory is a much sought after prize. I have many customers lined up in far off places to purchase it. I could be convinced to let you in on a cut of the profits. The wild elekk roaming Nagrand have the high quality of tusks that I'm after. Steer clear of the bull elekk; their ivory isn't in the condition that I desire. Oh and don't worry
column2: it's not poaching; I have an understanding with both the orcs and the draenei. Do you and I have an understanding?

column1: Bleeding Hollow Supply Crates^66^Horde^Nagrand^Elkay'gan the Mystic^Elkay'gan the Mystic^Standards and Practices^^^Elkay'gan the Mystic at Garadar in Nagrand wants you to recover 10 Bleeding Hollow Supply Crates.^The Boulderfist have moved the supplies they stole from our village to the twin clefts of Nagrand
column2: found west of here in the Halaani Basin. While you are in the area
column3: keep your eye out for the supply crates. If we can get those back
column4: it would ease much of the burden that has fallen upon the matrons of Garadar.

column1: Do My Eyes Deceive Me^65^Alliance^Nagrand^Huntress Bintook^Huntress Bintook^Do My Eyes Deceive Me^^^Huntress Bintook at Telaar in Nagrand wants you to recover Boulderfist Plans.^Do my eyes deceive me or is there an ogre hunting party over yonder? What could ogres be doing this far from their mound? I don't like this one bit
column2: stranger. First Murkbloods and now ogres. We just don't have the manpower to handle all of these threats to our land. Could you investigate the ogre presence to the east for us? Their forward camp is about 200 paces east of here. You'll know you're at the right place if you see the Boulderfist hunters. Kill them to find the plans!

column1: Not On My Watch!^65^Alliance^Nagrand^Huntress Bintook^Huntress Bintook^Do My Eyes Deceive Me^^^Huntress Bintook at Telaar in Nagrand wants you to speak to Lump. Return to Huntress Bintook when you have gathered the information that she requested.^The battle plans were written up by an ogre lieutenant. His name is either Dump or Lump. <Bintook turns the parchment sideways and cocks her head.> It could also be Billy. Anyhow
column2: I think you should go back out there and have a word with Billy or Lump or Dumpy or whatever! Try to approach him diplomatically. If that doesn't work
column3: try using some muscle.

column1: Sporeggar^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Fahssn^Msshi'fn^^^^Go to Sporeggar in Zangarmarsh
column2: north of the Spawning Glen
column3: and deliver the Salvaged Spore Sacs to Msshi'fn.^You're a kind <race>
column4: <name>. Not like some of the others I've met. You should meet the rest of my people; they'll be very grateful for your help. Take these spore sacs to my leader
column5: Msshi'fn. You will find him in Sporeggar
column6: north of here.

column1: Mo'mor the Breaker^65^Alliance^Nagrand^Huntress Bintook^Mo'mor the Breaker^Do My Eyes Deceive Me^^^Huntress Bintook at Telaar in Nagrand wants you to speak to Mo'mor the Breaker.^You must seek out Mo'mor immediately! You will find him in the center of Telaar
column2: by the fountain. Tell him exactly what the ogre told you.

column1: The Ruins of Burning Blade^65^Alliance^Nagrand^Mo'mor the Breaker^Mo'mor the Breaker^Do My Eyes Deceive Me^^^Mo'mor the Breaker at Telaar in Nagrand wants you to kill 8 Boulderfist Crushers and 8 Boulderfist Mystics.^These ogre hunting parties are a precursor to invasion. We must strike at them before they have a chance to amass an army big enough to take over our town. You're going to need to get your hands dirty
column2: <race>. The largest collection of Boulderfist in this region can be found at the Burning Blade Ruins
column3: almost directly east of Telaar
column4: near the border of Terokkar. Go there and show the Boulderfist that Telaar will not bend to their will!

column1: The Twin Clefts of Nagrand^66^Alliance^Nagrand^Mo'mor the Breaker^Mo'mor the Breaker^Do My Eyes Deceive Me^^^Mo'mor the Breaker at Telaar in Nagrand has asked that you slay 10 Boulderfist Warriors and 10 Boulderfist Mages.^You made a strong showing
column2: <name>. Are you ready for more? I have received reports of a large contingent of Boulderfist ogres hidden in the twin clefts of Nagrand
column3: northwest of here in the Halaani Basin. Venture forth to the clefts and deal with the remaining Boulderfist ogres.

column1: HELP!^65^Alliance^Nagrand^Corki^Arechron^HELP!^^^Find the Boulderfist Key and Free Corki. Speak with Arechron in Telaar should you succeed.^HELP! They're gonna eat me! I just know it! Find the key
column2: I know it has to be on one of these ogres. If you get me out of here
column3: my father will reward you handsomely! He's the leader of Telaar
column4: Arechron.

column1: Corki's Gone Missing Again!^66^Alliance^Nagrand^Arechron^Arechron^HELP!^^Corki's Ransom^Arechron at Telaar has asked that you find and free Corki.^<Arechron sighs.> This is so embarrassing. Do you remember my boy
column2: Corki? You rescued him from the Burning Blade Ruins recently. Well
column3: his curiosity has gotten the best of him once more. He told me that he was going to investigate the Boulderfist menace for 'uncle' Mo'mor and ran off to the ogre mounds in the Halaani Basin
column4: north of here. Do you think you could track him down? I would be eternally grateful.

column1: Matters of Security^66^All^Nagrand^Zerid^Zerid^^^^Zerid at Aeris Landing in Nagrand wants you to kill 8 Voidspawn near Oshu'gun.^Gezhe chose to base our operations as close to Oshu'gun as possible
column2: without any regard for the safety of our crew. Why? Because he projected a ten percent increase in productivity by setting up shop here instead of in the mountains to the south. Never mind the crazed voidspawn wandering all of ten feet away from us. That would be the security officer's problem
column3: not Gezhe's. Kill some voidspawn for me and I'll pay you a tenth of our security budget. Don't get excited
column4: it's not much of a budget.

column1: Ruthless Cunning^66^All^Nagrand^Lantresor of the Blade^Lantresor of the Blade^^Diplomatic Measures^Returning the Favor
column2: Body of Evidence^Lantresor of the Blade at the Burning Blade Ruins in Nagrand wants you to drive 10 Warmaul Ogre Banners through the bodies of Kil'sorrow members at Kil'sorrow Fortress.^<Lantresor hands you a pack full of banners.> These are Warmaul ogre banners that I recently acquired. I want you to travel to Kil'sorrow Fortress
column3: directly south of here
column4: and kill as many of the Kil'sorrow filth as you can find. Drive a Warmaul ogre banner through the heart of each fallen Kil'sorrow soldier. Return to me when you have completed this task and the other that this plan requires.

column1: Armaments for Deception^66^All^Nagrand^Lantresor of the Blade^Lantresor of the Blade^^Diplomatic Measures^^Lantresor of the Blade at the Burning Blade Ruins in Nagrand wants you to collect 10 Kil'sorrow Armaments.^You will need to steal Kil'sorrow armaments from Kil'sorrow Fortress if my plan is to work. Search the fortress for crates of Kil'sorrow armaments. Bring whatever you can find to me. Kil'sorrow Fortress is located directly south and a little to the west of the Burning Blade Ruins.
Returning the Favor^66^All^Nagrand^Lantresor of the Blade^Lantresor of the Blade^^Ruthless Cunning^Message to Telaar
column2: Message to Garadar^Lantresor of the Blade at the Burning Blade Ruins in Nagrand wants you to drive 10 Kil'sorrow Banners through the bodies of Warmaul ogres at the Laughing Skull Ruins.^Now you must plant the seed of war in the fat
column3: useless heads of the Warmaul. To the northwest
column4: near the mountains
column5: you will find the Laughing Skull Ruins. <Lantresor points into the crate of armaments you brought him.> Do you recognize those banners? They are Kil'sorrow banners. I want you to take a stack of Kil'sorrow banners and plant them on the corpses of Warmaul ogres. Remember
column6: northwest is where you will find the ogres.

column1: Body of Evidence^66^All^Nagrand^Lantresor of the Blade^Lantresor of the Blade^^Ruthless Cunning^^Lantresor of the Blade at the Burning Blade Ruins in Nagrand wants you to use the Damp Woolen Blanket at the Blazing Warmaul Pyre in the Laughing Skull Courtyard to signal his ogres.^Your rampage through Kil'sorrow Fortress has provided us with a special opportunity. We have enough bodies to make it appear as if a great battle has taken place. Travel to the Laughing Skull Ruins and find the Laughing Skull Courtyard. There should be a blazing pyre in the courtyard. Make sure the area is secure and then use this blanket to send up smoke signals. When my ogres see the smoke
column2: they will sneak in and plant the bodies of slain Kil'sorrow soldiers. That should be the final straw!

column1: Message to Telaar^66^Alliance^Nagrand^Lantresor of the Blade^Arechron^^Returning the Favor^^Take the Burning Blade Peace Offering to Arechron at Telaar in Nagrand.^<Lantresor points to an unmarked crate.> Take it. It is my offering to your people. You have single-handedly saved my clan from extermination. You may tell your leader that Lantresor of the Burning Blade and his Boulderfist ogres accept the offering of peace. <Lantresor bows.>

Message to Garadar^66^Horde^Nagrand^Lantresor of the Blade^Garrosh^^Returning the Favor^A Visit With the Greatmother^Take the Burning Blade Peace Offering to Garrosh at Garadar.^<Lantresor points to an unmarked crate.> Take it. It is my offering to your people. You have single-handedly saved my clan from extermination. You may tell your leader that Lantresor of the Burning Blade and his Boulderfist ogres accept the offering of peace. <Lantresor bows.>

Wanted: Giselda the Crone^66^Horde^Nagrand^Garadar Bulletin Board^Warden Bullrok^^^Wanted: Durn the Hungerer^Slay Giselda the Crone and any combination of 10 Kil'sorrow Agents. Return to Warden Bullrok at Garadar should you complete this task.^Wanted: Dead or Alive Giselda the Crone of Kil'sorrow and her lackeys for murder
column2: ritual sacrifice
column3: communing with the Legion
column4: kidnapping
column5: and burglary. Known to congregate at Kil'sorrow Fortress in southeastern Nagrand
column6: near the border of Terokkar. Large gold reward to be dispensed by Warden Bullrok at Garadar to anyone able to bring Giselda to justice.

column1: Wanted: Giselda the Crone^66^Alliance^Nagrand^Telaar Bulletin Board^Warden Moi'bff Jill^^^Wanted: Durn the Hungerer^Slay Giselda the Crone and any combination of 10 Kil'sorrow Agents. Return to Warden Moi'bff Jill at Telaar should you complete this task.^Wanted: Dead or Alive Giselda the Crone of Kil'sorrow and her lackeys for murder
column2: ritual sacrifice
column3: communing with the Legion
column4: kidnapping
column5: and burglary. Known to congregate at Kil'sorrow Fortress in southeastern Nagrand
column6: near the border of Terokkar. Large gold reward to be dispensed by Warden Moi'bff Jill at Telaar to anyone able to bring Giselda to justice.

column1: Wanted: Durn the Hungerer^67^Horde^Nagrand^Warden Bullrok^Warden Bullrok^^Wanted: Giselda the Crone
column2: Wanted: Zorbo the Advisor^^Slay Durn the Hungerer. Return to Warden Bullrok if you manage to complete this task.^You have destroyed two of the biggest threats in Nagrand
column3: <name>. Are you ready to take on the scourge of the Spirit Fields? Durn the Hungerer lords over the area surrounding Oshu'gun
column4: decimating all in his path. Thus far
column5: none have been able to rid Nagrand of this ferocious gronn. Gather your allies and venture to the Spirit Fields
column6: far southwest of here
column7: near Oshu'gun
column8: and track down Durn. Slay him and I assure you rewards commensurate with the difficulty of the task at hand.

column1: Wanted: Durn the Hungerer^67^Alliance^Nagrand^Warden Moi'bff Jill^Warden Moi'bff Jill^^Wanted: Giselda the Crone
column2: Wanted: Zorbo the Advisor^^Slay Durn the Hungerer. Return to Warden Moi'bff Jill if you manage to complete this task.^You have destroyed two of the biggest threats in Nagrand
column3: <name>. Are you ready to take on the scourge of the Spirit Fields? Durn the Hungerer lords over the area surrounding Oshu'gun
column4: decimating all in his path. Thus far
column5: none have been able to rid Nagrand of this ferocious gronn. Gather your allies and venture to the Spirit Fields
column6: west of here
column7: and track down Durn. Slay him and I assure you rewards commensurate with the difficulty of the task at hand.

column1: Wanted: Zorbo the Advisor^66^Horde^Nagrand^Garadar Bulletin Board^Warden Bullrok^^^Wanted: Durn the Hungerer^Slay Zorbo the Advisor
column2: 5 Warmaul Shaman and 5 Warmaul Reavers. Return to Warden Bullrok if you manage to complete this task.^Wanted: Dead or Alive Zorbo the Advisor
column3: wanted for numerous planned attacks on Garadar. Along with his reavers and shaman
column4: Zorbo has slain countless orcs. Consider Zorbo as armed
column5: dangerous
column6: and merciless. Zorbo makes his home in the Laughing Skull Ruins in the northern mountains of Nagrand. Reward for Zorbo the Advisor's death or capture to be dispensed by Warden Bullrok at Garadar.

column1: Wanted: Zorbo the Advisor^66^Alliance^Nagrand^Telaar Bulletin Board^Warden Moi'bff Jill^^^Wanted: Durn the Hungerer^Slay Zorbo the Advisor
column2: 5 Warmaul Shaman and 5 Warmaul Reavers. Return to Warden Moi'bff Jill if you manage to complete this task.^Wanted: Dead or Alive Zorbo the Advisor
column3: wanted for numerous planned attacks on Telaar. Along with his reavers and shaman
column4: Zorbo has slain countless Broken. Consider Zorbo as armed
column5: dangerous
column6: and merciless. Zorbo makes his home in the Laughing Skull Ruins in the northern mountains of Nagrand. Reward for Zorbo the Advisor's death or capture to be dispensed by Warden Moi'bff Jill at Telaar.

column1: Missing Mag'hari Procession^67^Horde^Nagrand^Matron Drakia^Elder Yorley^Missing Mag'hari Procession^^^Search for the missing Mag'hari procession.^Greatmother says that we must press on and serve our people. She says that we must serve as an example for Garrosh - to show that life goes on. I have so many matters to attend to here
column2: especially with Greatmother having taken ill. Would you honor the Mag'har by helping one of their matrons? Several days ago we sent a funeral procession to the Ancestral Grounds and they have yet to return. Will you go search for them? They took the western road out of Garadar. Follow it around and avoid Halaa.

column1: War on the Warmaul^67^Horde^Nagrand^Elder Yorley^Elder Yorley^Missing Mag'hari Procession^^^Elder Yorley at the Mag'hari Procession in Nagrand has asked that you slay 8 Warmaul Brutes and 8 Warmaul Warlocks.^We were en route to the Ancestral Grounds when we were ambushed by Warmaul. They came from all sides
