column2: killing several of the procession guards and many of the others. They even desecrated the remains of the elder in the wagon. And for what? So they could humiliate us and display their power. Not even Boulderfist would have sunk so low. I am a spiritual orc
column3: <name>
column4: but even I have limitations. Find the attackers at Warmaul Hill to the northwest and destroy them!

column1: Cho'war the Pillager^67^Horde^Nagrand^Elder Yorley^Elder Yorley^Missing Mag'hari Procession^^^Elder Yorley at the Mag'hari Procession in Nagrand has asked that you slay Cho'war the Pillager and retrieve the Head of Cho'war.^Have you ever seen an ogre king
column2: <race>? Few have and lived to tell the tale. Unfortunately
column3: that is exactly what we are dealing with here. The leader of these barbarians is an ogre named Cho'war. Rumor has it that Cho'war was the ogre responsible for forcing the gronn out of the cave. Cho'war then declared himself king and dissolved the ogre clans that served under the gronn. Thus
column4: Warmaul was born. Find Cho'war deep in the caves of Warmaul Hill. Slay him and bring me his head.

column1: Finding the Survivors^67^Horde^Nagrand^Elder Ungriz^Elder Ungriz^^^^Elder Ungriz at the Mag'hari Procession in Nagrand has asked that you free 5 Mag'har Prisoners.^If I know anything about ogres
column2: it's that they like their food fresh. This means that the Mag'har that they captured are more than likely being kept alive until they are ready to serve. It's a sickening thought
column3: I know
column4: but one that we must use to our advantage. Venture to Warmaul Hill and search for Mag'har prisoners. If you find prisoners
column5: then you will find keys to their cages on the nearby Warmaul ogres. Kill ogres for their keys and release the prisoners.

column1: It's Watching You!^64^All^Terokkar Forest^Warden Treelos^Warden Treelos^^^^Kill Naphthal'ar and then return to Warden Treelos at the Cenarion Thicket in Terokkar Forest.^Quick
column2: hide! The eyes of Naphthal'ar are upon you... upon us all! I dare not go to the top of the tower to speak with it
column3: but you... you look as if you might know the right words to say. Just be careful
column4: it doesn't like jokes and will not suffer fools easily. If you can
column5: convince it to come down for tea. But
column6: by all means
column7: get it to stop staring at me!

column1: Corki's Ransom^67^Alliance^Nagrand^Arechron^Corki^Corki's Ransom^Corki's Gone Missing Again!^^Arechron wants you to find Corki at Warmaul Hill.^<Arechron shows you a grime covered letter.> I just received this letter. It's from a clan of ogres known as Warmaul that rule the northwestern lands of Nagrand. It says that they have Corki and if we don't cooperate
column2: they're going to eat him. Admittedly
column3: Corki is a moron
column4: but he's still my blood. Will you rescue him
column5: <name>? I presume that he's locked up in a cage somewhere on Warmaul Hill. That should be your first stop.

column1: Cho'war the Pillager^67^Alliance^Nagrand^Corki^Arechron^Corki's Ransom^^^Corki wants you to get Cho'war's Key so that you can free him from his cage. Return to Arechron at Telaar should you manage this task.^They call him Cho'war the pillager
column2: <name>. He's the ogre that forced out the gronn that used to rule over these ogres. You better believe he's powerful! The chef said that Cho'war lives in the big cave - wherever that may be... Get that key and get me out of here! If we live through this
column3: my father will no doubt give you the big reward! As soon as I'm free
column4: seek him out.

column1: The Ravaged Caravan^67^All^Nagrand^Huntress Kima^Huntress Kima^^^^Huntress Kima at Telaar in Nagrand wants you to recover 10 Telaar Supply Crates.^I was part of a caravan taking supplies to the Orebor Harborage in Zangarmarsh. As we were nearing the border of the marsh
column2: we were jumped by a vicious squad of Warmaul ogres. They killed the others and took me prisoner
column3: along with all of our supplies. Thankfully
column4: they neglected to place a backing on my cage. When they fell asleep
column5: I made my escape. It's too late for my comrades but we could really use the supplies they stole. Warmaul Hill is in the northwestern mountains of Nagrand.

column1: What's Wrong at Cenarion Thicket?^63^All^Terokkar Forest^Lethyn Moonfire^Earthbinder Tavgren^^^Strange Energy^Speak with one of the druids at the Cenarion Thicket in Terokkar Forest.^We haven't heard from the druids at the Cenarion Thicket of Terokkar Forest in quite some time. <name>
column2: I'd like for you to go down there and check in with them to see what's happening. There are several ways to get there
column3: but the fastest is to head south along the path
column4: and then take the road that branches east from Shattrath City once you're in the forest.

column1: What's Wrong at Cenarion Thicket?^63^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Tooki^Earthbinder Tavgren^^^Strange Energy^Speak with one of the druids at the Cenarion Thicket in Terokkar Forest.^Hey there
column2: <class>. We haven't heard from the druids of the Cenarion Thicket in quite some time. I want you to go over there and check to see what's happening. You can find it by heading northwest through the forest.

column1: What's Wrong at Cenarion Thicket?^63^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Jenai Starwhisper^Earthbinder Tavgren^^^Strange Energy^Speak with one of the druids at the Cenarion Thicket in Terokkar Forest.^<class>
column2: I have urgent business for you. We haven't heard from the druids of the Cenarion Thicket in quite some time. This is unusual as we usually hear from them at least once every few days. I want you to go up there and make sure that they're alright. You can find the thicket by heading northwest through the forest.

column1: What's Wrong at Cenarion Thicket?^63^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Jenai Starwhisper^Earthbinder Tavgren^^^Strange Energy^Speak with one of the druids at the Cenarion Thicket in Terokkar Forest.^<class>
column2: I have urgent business for you. We haven't heard from the druids of the Cenarion Thicket in quite some time. This is unusual as we usually hear from them at least once every few days. I want you to go up there and make sure that they're alright. You can find the thicket by heading northwest through the forest.

column1: The Ring of Blood: The Blue Brothers^67^All^Nagrand^Gurgthock^Wodin the Troll-Servant^^The Ring of Blood: Brokentoe^The Ring of Blood: Rokdar the Sundered L^Defeat the Murkblood Twins that call themselves the Blue Brothers. Should you win
column2: speak with Wodin the Troll-Servant to collect your reward.^This next battle involves a duo - twin brothers to be precise. They call themselves the "Blue Brothers." It's not too late to chicken out
column3: <name>. I'd certainly understand. But if you're ready for some action
column4: step in the Ring of Blood and wait for the Murkblood twins to arrive. Last one standing is the winner!

column1: Strange Energy^63^All^Terokkar Forest^Earthbinder Tavgren^Earthbinder Tavgren^^^By Any Means Necessary^Collect 4 Teromoth Samples and 4 Vicious Teromoth Samples. Then return to Earthbinder Tavgren just outside of the Cenarion Thicket in Terokkar Forest.^Something strange has changed the teromoths of the thicket. Where once there was a diversity of life in there
column2: now only the teromoths remain. And while before they were at peace
column3: now they are agitated and will not hesitate to attack you should you get close. I need to compare the vicious ones to the normal. Collect for me a number of samples from both. You'll find the unaffected teromoths both to the south and the north. I'm certain this is related to whatever killed all of the druids.

column1: The Ring of Blood: Rokdar the Sundered Lord^67^All^Nagrand^Gurgthock^Wodin the Troll-Servant^^The Ring of Blood: The Blue Brothers^The Ring of Blood: Skra'gath^Defeat Rokdar the Sundered Lord. Should you win
column2: speak with Wodin the Troll-Servant to collect your reward.^This fight is gonna be painful
column3: <name>. Do you have any friends that are brave enough to help you out? The ogres managed to get a giant from Blade's Edge named Rokdar! Trust me
column4: you're gonna need friends
column5: he seems unbeatable! He's hard as a rock - literally! If you still want to fight him
column6: step into the Ring of Blood and he will come.

column1: Clues in the Thicket^63^All^Terokkar Forest^Earthbinder Tavgren^Earthbinder Tavgren^^^^Investigate the Strange Object next to the Broken Corpse to determine what might have befallen the Cenarion Thicket. Then return to Earthbinder Tavgren just outside the thicket in Terokkar Forest.^I have no idea what killed all of the druids here. I've been away for a couple of days on a survey of the Bone Wastes to the south. Please
column2: you must help me to uncover what's behind this horrible tragedy. Go into the thicket and look for a clue that might reveal something to us. When I was in there briefly
column3: I could have sworn I saw a dead Broken and a strange object next to him. And don't worry about Treelos - he might have been driven insane by what happened
column4: but I think he's mostly harmless.

column1: The Ring of Blood: Skra'gath^67^All^Nagrand^Gurgthock^Wodin the Troll-Servant^^The Ring of Blood: Rokdar the Sundered L^The Ring of Blood: The Warmaul Champion^Defeat Skra'gath. Should you win
column2: speak with Wodin the Troll-Servant to collect your reward.^You're murderin' 'em out there
column3: kid! They got a ringer for the next match. They say he's a void lord or something... No way do they want you up against their champion. Did you here that palooka
column4: Mogor
column5: yapping at you? The bets are through the roof! Get in that ring and take this one out fast!

column1: The Ring of Blood: The Warmaul Champion^67^All^Nagrand^Gurgthock^Wodin the Troll-Servant^^The Ring of Blood: Skra'gath^The Ring of Blood: The Final Challenge^Defeat the Warmaul Champion. Should you win
column2: speak with Wodin the Troll-Servant to collect your reward.^They had to ship the champion in from the Blade's Edge gladiator pits. He was training on mountain giants - three at a time. If you win this one
column3: you become the new champion. What do you think your odds are
column4: kid? Do you have a shot? Just give me the word and I'll bet the house on you. Now get in there and win!

column1: The Ring of Blood: The Final Challenge^68^All^Nagrand^Gurgthock^Wodin the Troll-Servant^^The Ring of Blood: The Warmaul Champion^The Amphitheater of Anguish: Yggdras!^Defeat Mogor
column2: Hero of the Warmaul. Should you win
column3: speak with Wodin the Troll-Servant to collect your reward.^<Gurgthock is counting his massive pile of gold.> You've made me a lot of money
column4: kid. If you can defeat Mogor
column5: I promise to make it worth your while. All that pain you suffered in the Ring of Blood is gonna end up paying off. Now get in there and show these ogres what you're made of!

column1: By Any Means Necessary^63^All^Terokkar Forest^Earthbinder Tavgren^Empoor^By Any Means Necessary^Strange Energy^Wind Trader Lathrai^Find Empoor on the road between Tuurem and Shattrath City in Terokkar Forest. Convince him to tell you what he knows.^I don't know what to make of all of this
column2: but I do know how we can find more clues. Empoor is a Broken merchant that traffics in all sorts of goods and information. If you were to persuade him to talk
column3: I'm sure he might have something interesting to say. He travels the road here between Tuurem and Shattrath. Watch out
column4: though -- he travels with a bodyguard.

column1: Wind Trader Lathrai^63^All^Shattrath City^Empoor^Wind Trader Lathrai^By Any Means Necessary^^^Speak with Wind Trader Lathrai near the World's End Tavern in the Lower City section of Shattrath City.^I was asked to pick up and deliver some boxes of goods from an ethereal in Shattrath City. Last I saw him
column2: he was standing outside of the World's End Tavern in Lower City. His name is Wind Trader Lathrai
column3: and that's all that I know! Want more answers
column4: go talk with him!

column1: He Called Himself Altruis...^68^Alliance^Nagrand^Huntress Kima^Altruis the Sufferer^^^Survey the Land^If you are looking to fight the Burning Legion
column2: find Altruis the Sufferer in western Nagrand.^A being riding atop a nether drake arrived in town late last week. He introduced himself as Altruis and then proceeded to ask us several questions about Nagrand. He claimed that he was hunting Legion. That such insanity was actually his job. Can you imagine? A person that would willingly hunt demons? Before he left
column3: he asked that we let the would-be heroes in town know that he will be staying in western Nagrand for awhile and that should they seek a purpose
column4: to find him.

column1: He Called Himself Altruis...^68^Horde^Nagrand^Matron Celestine^Altruis the Sufferer^^^Survey the Land^If you are looking to fight the Burning Legion
column2: find Altruis the Sufferer in western Nagrand.^A being riding atop a nether drake arrived in town late last week. He introduced himself as Altruis and then proceeded to ask us several questions about Nagrand. He claimed that he was hunting Legion. That such insanity was actually his job. Can you imagine? A person that would willingly hunt demons? Before he left
column3: he asked that we let the would-be heroes in town know that he will be staying in western Nagrand for awhile and that should they seek a purpose
column4: to find him.

column1: Host of the Hidden City^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Luanga's Orders^Andarl^^^^Take Luanga's Orders to Andarl at the Allerian Stronghold in Terokkar Forest.^Although you cannot read the strange script on the scroll
column2: the ornate seal at the bottom of the document implies that it was drafted by an arakkoa of high standing. Luanga may have masterminded the capture and interrogation of Deirom
column3: but it seems he was taking orders from someone else. You remember Thander mentioning that Andarl has studied the arakkoa. Perhaps he can decipher the scroll's contents.

column1: Host of the Hidden City^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Luanga's Orders^Kurgatok^^^^Bring Luanga's Orders to Kurgatok at Stonebreaker Hold in Terokkar Forest.^Although you cannot read the strange script on the scroll
column2: the ornate seal at the bottom of the document implies that it was drafted by an arakkoa of high standing. Luanga may have masterminded the capture and interrogation of Dugar
column3: but it seems he was taking orders from someone else. You remember Rokag mentioning that Kurgatok has studied the arakkoa. Perhaps he can decipher the scroll's contents.

column1: Stymying the Arakkoa^64^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Thander^Thander^^^^Kill Ashkaz in Veil Reskk
column2: Ayit in Veil Shienor
column3: and Urdak in Veil Skith and return to Thander at the Allerian Stronghold.^We need to show the arakkoa that they cannot attack our people with impunity. If we don't stop them here
column4: the roads will no longer be safe for our merchants
column5: couriers
column6: or soldiers. My scouts have identified the leaders of each of the major arakkoa settlements in the area. Seek out Ashkaz
column7: Ayit
column8: and Urdak
column9: in Veil Reskk
column10: Veil Shienor
column11: and Veil Skith and kill them.

column1: Stymying the Arakkoa^64^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Rokag^Rokag^^^^Kill Ashkaz in Veil Reskk
column2: Ayit in Veil Shienor
column3: and Urdak in Veil Skith and return to Rokag at Stonebreaker Hold.^We need to show the arakkoa that they cannot attack our people with impunity. If we don't stop them here
column4: the roads will no longer be safe for our merchants
column5: couriers
column6: or soldiers. My scouts have identified the leaders of each of the major arakkoa settlements in the area. Seek out Ashkaz
column7: Ayit
column8: and Urdak
column9: in Veil Reskk
column10: Veil Shienor
column11: and Veil Skith and kill them.

column1: Investigate Tuurem^64^All^Terokkar Forest^Wind Trader Lathrai^Earthbinder Tavgren^By Any Means Necessary^^What Are These Things?
column2: What Are These Things?^Find the Sealed Box and then deliver it to Earthbinder Tavgren just outside of the Cenarion Thicket in Terokkar Forest.^You know
column3: come to think of it
column4: I do recall selling several boxes of strange and exotic engineering parts to Empoor about a month ago. I'm not sure what they'd be used for
column5: but I know that they were delivered to Tuurem. Perhaps one or more of those boxes is still there?

column1: Survey the Land^68^All^Nagrand^Altruis the Sufferer^Altruis the Sufferer^Survey the Land^^^Sit back and enjoy the ride. Speak to Altruis when the survey is complete.^To be my eyes will require some diligence on your part. Nethrandamus will take you through the Legion camps
column2: but you must catalog everything that you see. Even the smallest detail that you may think to be inconsequential could be useful for our purposes. Primarily
column3: I want you to note what structures are in the camps and what comprises the camps' defenses. Nethrandamus is ready when you are
column4: <name>. Do not be afraid
column5: he will keep you safe from harm.

column1: Olemba Seeds^63^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Ros'eleth^Ros'eleth^Olemba Seeds^^^Gather 30 Olemba Seeds and return them to Ros'eleth in the Allerian Stronghold.^Aren't the trees in the forest beautiful? I've often wondered if they would survive on Azeroth. I'm hesitant to send back seedlings
column2: though. It's a rough trip and they're much harder to transport than something like a sack of seeds. The seeds are stored in tough cones that fall from the tree's branches once they've reached maturity. If you come upon some of those cones in your travels
column3: would you mind bringing some of the seeds back to me?

column1: Olemba Seed Oil^63^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Rakoria^Rakoria^Olemba Seed Oil^^^Bring 30 Olemba Seeds to Rakoria in Stonebreaker Hold.^The oily seeds from the forest's olemba trees could prove very valuable. I'd like to gather a larger quantity of them
column2: press them for their oil
column3: and then see what I can do with it. Just think
column4: there's a whole forest full of trees out there
column5: producing a lot of seeds that go to waste. I don't care if it turns out to be cooking oil
column6: lamp oil
column7: or weapon oil
column8: I won't let it go to waste! Bring me any of the seeds that you happen to gather from the olemba cones. They're all over the place.

column1: What Are These Things?^64^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Earthbinder Tavgren^Jenai Starwhisper^What Are These Things?^Investigate Tuurem^^Deliver the Box of Parts to Jenai Starwhisper at the Allerian Stronghold in Terokkar Forest.^I don't know about you
column2: but I have no idea what all of those things are. I do know one thing though - they look dangerous! <name>
column3: I think you should take this box of parts to Jenai Starwhisper at the Allerian Stronghold to the southeast. She may have some idea of what these are.

column1: What Are These Things?^64^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Earthbinder Tavgren^Tooki^What Are These Things?^Investigate Tuurem^^Deliver the Box of Parts to Tooki at Stonebreaker Hold in Terokkar Forest.^I don't know about you
column2: but I have no idea what all of those things are. I do know one thing though - they look dangerous! <name>
column3: I think you should take this box of parts to Tooki at Stonebreaker Hold to the southeast. He may have some idea of what these are.

column1: Attack on Firewing Point^64^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Lieutenant Meridian^Lieutenant Meridian^What Are These Things?^^^Kill 10 Firewing Defenders
column2: 10 Firewing Bloodwarders
column3: and 10 Firewing Warlocks. Then report back to Lieutenant Meridian at the Allerian Post in Terokkar Forest.^We know that the blood elves of Firewing Point are working for Kael'thas and Illidan. And from what you've told me
column4: clearly they are using the Broken of Tuurem as smuggling go-betweens for the creation of some horrible weapon. Whatever they're up to out there
column5: the most efficient thing that we can do right now is to thin out their numbers. The Firewing blood elves need to be taken out! Head up to Firewing Point to the north and see to it.

column1: Attack on Firewing Point^64^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Sergeant Chawni^Sergeant Chawni^What Are These Things?^^^Kill 10 Firewing Defenders
column2: 10 Firewing Bloodwarders
column3: and 10 Firewing Warlocks. Then report back to Sergeant Chawni at Stonebreaker Camp in Terokkar Forest.^We know that the blood elves of Firewing Point are working for Kael'thas and Illidan. And from what you've told me
column4: clearly they are using the Broken of Tuurem as smuggling go-betweens for the creation of some horrible weapon. Whatever they're up to out there
column5: the most efficient thing that we can do right now is to thin out their numbers. The Firewing blood elves need to be taken out! Head over to Firewing Point to the northeast and see to it.

column1: Unruly Neighbors^63^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Bertelm^Theloria Shadecloak^^^The Firewing Liaison
column2: Thinning the Ranks^Kill 12 Warped Peons and then report to Theloria Shadecloak at the Allerian Post.^The recent arrival of the fel orcs at the ruins to the east both puzzles and troubles Thander. They wasted no time in starting to construct fortifications and repair the buildings. The construction goes on day and night
column3: <name>. I've dispatched one of my most reliable agents to keep watch
column4: but we can ill afford to delay action. Move against their workers
column5: then seek out Theloria Shadecloak at the Allerian Post to the north of the Bonechewer Ruins. She'll give you further instructions.

column1: Buying Time^68^All^Nagrand^Altruis the Sufferer^Altruis the Sufferer^Survey the Land^^^Altruis the Sufferer in western Nagrand has asked that you kill 2 Felguard Legionnaires
column2: 3 Mo'arg Engineers and 8 Gan'arg Tinkerers.^As long as the transporters stand
column3: nothing we do to the forge camps will have any permanence. We must find a way to destroy the Legion structures. I need time to devise a plan of attack. If you can keep their engineers and tinkerers busy
column4: it would greatly slow down their progress
column5: buying me the time I need. Stay as far away as possible from the overseers
column6: <name>. They are extremely dangerous beings.

column1: An Unwelcome Presence^63^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Kurgatok^Shadowstalker Kaide^^^The Firewing Liaison
column2: What Happens in Terokkar Stays in Terokk^Kill 12 Warped Peons and then report to Shadowstalker Kaide.^Our forces at Thrallmar thought they had the fel orcs contained in the Hellfire Citadel area
column3: but the recent arrivals at the ruins to the east say otherwise. We can't permit them to gain a foothold here. Rokag has dispatched Shadowstalker Kaide to the ruins to keep an eye on them
column4: but we have to do something to keep them from digging in. Go to the ruins
column5: decimate their peons
column6: and then look for Kaide in the trees to the north. He'll tell you where to go from there.

column1: The Master Planner^68^All^Nagrand^Altruis the Sufferer^Altruis the Sufferer^Survey the Land^^^Altruis the Sufferer in western Nagrand has asked that you recover the Master Planner's Blueprints.^All forge camps have a master planner. The master planner dictates what types of structures are present at a forge camp and how each structure is situated. Moreover
column2: this information is kept on a set of blueprints that the planner carries around on their person. We need the master planner's blueprints. Armed with such exacting information
column3: we could persuade an acquaintance of mine to lend some assistance. Find the mo'arg master planner and take his blueprints. He will be stationed behind the forges.

column1: The Firewing Liaison^64^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Theloria Shadecloak^Theloria Shadecloak^^Unruly Neighbors^^Locate and slay Lisaile Fireweaver
column2: then return to Theloria Shadecloak.^Over the past couple of days
column3: I've observed a blood elf woman traveling to and from the fel orc stronghold and conversing with the fel orc leader. From her body language
column4: she's clearly issuing orders. But why? Whose orders is she conveying? My curiosity got the better of my judgment and I shadowed her when she left the fel orc encampment. She headed north
column5: to Firewing Point. I stopped before reaching the perimeter of the blood elf outpost. Kill her before she leaves the fel orc camp again.

column1: The Firewing Liaison^64^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Shadowstalker Kaide^Shadowstalker Kaide^^An Unwelcome Presence^^Locate and slay Lisaile Fireweaver
column2: then return to Shadowstalker Kaide.^Over the past couple of days
column3: I've observed a blood elf woman traveling to and from the fel orc stronghold and conversing with the fel orc leader. From her body language
column4: she's clearly issuing orders. But why? Whose orders is she conveying? My curiosity got the better of my judgment and I shadowed her when she left the fel orc encampment. She headed north
column5: to Firewing Point. I stopped before reaching the perimeter of the blood elf outpost. Kill her before she leaves the fel orc camp again.

column1: Patience and Understanding^68^All^Nagrand^Altruis the Sufferer^Sal'salabim^Survey the Land^^^Altruis the Sufferer in western Nagrand wants you to take the Master Planner's Blueprints to Sal'salabim in Shattrath City and convince him to help you.^Take the blueprints and travel to Shattrath City in the Terokkar forest. Once at Shattrath
column2: go to the Lower City and look for a mo'arg by the name Sal'salabim. He'll probably be at the bar
column3: drinking away his sorrows. By the way
column4: you may need to convince him to lend his assistance. Try to approach him with patience and understanding. If that does not work
column5: use your fists.

column1: Letting Earthbinder Tavgren Know^63^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Jenai Starwhisper^Earthbinder Tavgren^^The Final Code^^Speak with Earthbinder Tavgren just outside the Cenarion Thicket in Terokkar Forest.^<name>
column2: after you're done celebrating here
column3: I think that you should go back to the Cenarion Thicket and speak with Earthbinder Tavgren. I'm certain that he'll want to know what really happened out there.

column1: Letting Earthbinder Tavgren Know^63^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Tooki^Earthbinder Tavgren^^The Final Code^^Speak with Earthbinder Tavgren just outside the Cenarion Thicket in Terokkar Forest.^<name>
column2: I think that after you're done celebrating here
column3: you should go back to the Cenarion Thicket and speak with Earthbinder Tavgren. I'm certain that he'll want to know what really happened out there.

column1: Thinning the Ranks^64^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Theloria Shadecloak^Theloria Shadecloak^^Unruly Neighbors^^Kill 10 Bonechewer Devastators and 6 Bonechewer Backbreakers and return to Theloria Shadecloak.^Knowing Thander and Bertelm
column2: they won't tolerate such a large buildup of hostile forces on our doorstep. Asking them to dispatch members of the garrison to participate in an attack on the camp isn't an option either. It would just leave us too vulnerable to attack. It falls to us to do what we can to diminish the threat the fel orc buildup poses. Kill what you can of their forces and I will look for ways to stall any reinforcements.

column1: What Happens in Terokkar Stays in Terokkar^64^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Shadowstalker Kaide^Shadowstalker Kaide^^An Unwelcome Presence^^Shadowstalker Kaide wants you to kill 10 Bonechewer Devastators and 6 Bonechewer Backbreakers.^If word reaches Thrallmar that they've failed to contain the fel orcs
column2: we're going to be receiving a lot of company down here. Frankly
column3: I'm not sure I want all that attention
column4: so we're going to keep this little problem under wraps
column5: got it? If we can inflict enough casualties on the fel orcs
column6: chances are their presence will never come to the attention of anyone outside Stonebreaker. So
column7: let's end it now. Wade in there
column8: swing your weapon
column9: wave your hands
column10: or whatever it is you do - just kill fel orcs.

column1: Crackin' Some Skulls^68^All^Terokkar Forest^Sal'salabim^Sal'salabim^Survey the Land^^^Sal'salabim at Shattrath City wants you to recover Raliq's Debt
column2: Coosh'coosh's Debt and Floon's Debt.^<Sal'salabim laughs.> This Sal'salabim design. <Sal'salabim points to the architecture and formations on the blueprints.> Look at towers. Demon hunter no can see
column3: yes? Poor
column4: poor Altruis. He cry if he had eyes
column5: yes? Yes
column6: Sal'salabim help but first you help Sal'salabim. <Sal'salabim gives you a ledger.> These creatures owe Sal'salabim golds. Many golds. Go collect for Sal'salabim and come back. They no give you Sal'salabim gold easy. Have to fight
column7: but you strong. You defeat Sal'salabim!

column1: It's Just That Easy?^68^All^Terokkar Forest^Sal'salabim^Altruis the Sufferer^Survey the Land^^^Sal'salabim at Shattrath City wants you to return to Altruis the Sufferer in western Nagrand.^<Sal'salabim points to the blueprint.> You see where fel cannons are? <Sal'salabim draws an arrow denoting a change of direction.> You turn fel cannon around and use on structures. Wait! Don't be mad! One thing you not know. Overseers have key to turn cannons. You need key first! One from each overseer! Not so easy
column2: eh? Take information back to Altruis.

column1: Forge Camp: Annihilated^68^All^Nagrand^Altruis the Sufferer^Altruis the Sufferer^Survey the Land^^A Visit With the Greatmother
column2: Against the Legion^Altruis the Sufferer in western Nagrand has asked that you Destroy Forge Camp: Hate and Destroy Forge Camp: Fear.^Gather your allies
column3: <name>. You will need them if you are to face an overseer. Once you have a suitable group
column4: find and kill the overseers at each camp. Take their keys and use them to turn and fire the fel cannons upon the camps. Return to me once the camps are destroyed.

column1: Fel Orc Plans^64^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Fel Orc Plans^Bertelm^^^^Bring the Fel Orc Plans to Bertelm at the Allerian Stronghold in Terokkar Forest.^The writing on the plans is far too delicate and precise to have come from any of the fel orcs. You can't make out what the text says
column2: but the implications are pretty clear: the fel orcs are taking orders from the blood elves at Firewing Point. Why would the two forces be working together? Bertelm might have some insight into this odd alliance. You decide to make your way back to the Allerian Stronghold and show him the map.

column1: An Unseen Hand^64^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Fel Orc Plans^Rokag^^^^Bring the Fel Orc Plans to Rokag at Stonebreaker Hold in Terokkar Forest.^The writing on the plans is far too delicate and precise to have come from any of the fel orcs. You can't make out what the text says
column2: but the implications are pretty clear: the fel orcs are taking orders from the blood elves at Firewing Point. Why would the two forces be working together? Rokag might have some insight into this odd alliance. You decide to make your way back to Stonebreaker Hold and show him the map.

column1: Timber Worg Tails^64^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Bertelm^Bertelm^Timber Worg Tails^^^Bertelm at the Allerian Stronghold wants you to bring him 12 Timber Worg Tails. The tails can come from either Timber Worgs or Timber Worg Alphas.^Have you come across the timber worgs in your travels? I've had the opportunity to observe them while mapping some of the northern reaches of the forest. I wouldn't recommend getting close to them unless you're prepared for combat. They have no fear of us and won't hesitate to defend their territory. It's fitting that such a creature would have a magnificent tail. I've been trying to collect enough of them to trim a new cloak
column2: but the worgs have a habit of evading my snares. Will you help?

column1: Strained Supplies^64^All^Shattrath City^Sha'nir^Sha'nir^^^More Venom Sacs^Bring 8 Dreadfang Venom Sacs to Sha'nir in Shattrath City.^More and more refugees come through the gates of Shattrath City each day. Some have sustained such injuries
column2: it's a real wonder they made it here. I can deal with most of the conventional injuries; my training as an Aldor healer has prepared me for that. Poison wounds are more problematic as my anti-venom supplies have begun to run low. Bring me venom sacs from the local dreadfang spiders so I can produce more antidotes. You'll find a pocket of the spiders in the southeastern region of Terokkar.

column1: Vestments of the Wolf Spirit^64^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Malukaz^Malukaz^Vestments of the Wolf Spirit^^^Bring 12 Timber Worg Pelts to Malukaz at Stonebreaker Hold.^Generations ago
column2: when orc clans still called Terokkar Forest home
column3: the wolf spirit played an important role in their lives. When the orcs departed
column4: they had no longer had any need for the spirit and they left it behind. In time
column5: the spirit grew lonely and it too left the forest. I believe I can bring the wolf spirit back to his ancestral home
column6: just as we orcs have returned. The ritual will require me to create vestments from the pelts of the wolves of the forest to guide the spirit back to its home.

column1: A Cure for Zahlia^64^All^Shattrath City^Sha'nir^Sha'nir^^^^Bring Stonegazer's Blood to Sha'nir in Shattrath City.^The woman to my right suffered a severe injury to the head. She survived
column2: but lost her eyesight. A traditional cure used among my people requires the blood of a very old basilisk. Unfortunately
column3: due to poaching from various groups
column4: Terokkar basilisks don't tend to live very long. There is one basilisk whose name I've known since I was a youngling. It is known only as "Stonegazer" and it's rumored to live east of here
column5: near the land's edge. Bring me its blood so that Zahlia may see once again.

column1: Restoring the Light^64^All^Shattrath City^Ishanah^Ishanah^^^^Ishanah wants you to go to the Arakkoa outpost east of Shattrath City and use the Blessed Vial to cleanse the Eastern Altar
column2: the Western Altar and the Northern Altar.^Much of this region was inhabited by draenei long ago. We Aldor were charged with the safeguarding of our holy sites and altars. Many of them have since been destroyed or taken over by our enemies. To the east of here there is an arakkoa outpost. It was purposefully built on the location of three of our sacred altars. The arakkoa use their foul magic to warp and defile the innate power of our shrines. Take this to the arakkoa outpost and use it to cleanse the three altars.

column1: The Elusive Ironjaw^64^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Bertelm^Bertelm^Timber Worg Tails^^^Bring Ironjaw's Pelt to Bertelm at the Allerian Stronghold.^Now that I have the fur I'll need for the trim
column2: I've been thinking that the pelt of a particular wolf would make a good hood for my cloak. Imagine seeing your enemy clad in the pelt of the most cunning predator in the forest! I've tried trapping old Ironjaw without success. I've tried cornering him
column3: outsmarting him
column4: and baiting him. None of it has worked. He stalks the northeastern reaches of the forest
column5: and I'd gladly reward you if you could succeed where I have failed.

column1: Patriarch Ironjaw^64^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Malukaz^Malukaz^Vestments of the Wolf Spirit^^^Bring Ironjaw's Pelt to Malukaz at Stonebreaker Hold.^You've done well in gathering the first pelts. The final piece of the vestments requires a pelt unlike any other. There is one particular wolf
column2: an old and cunning one
column3: that has earned his place as the patriarch of the forest wolves. He is known among them as Ironjaw
column4: the mighty hunter. In my visions
column5: I have seen him wandering the northeastern region of the forest. Including his pelt in the vestments will surely light the wolf spirit's path. Do not mourn Ironjaw. He will be well honored.

column1: Voren'thal's Visions^65^All^Shattrath City^Arcanist Adyria^Arcanist Adyria^^^More Basilisk Eyes^Bring 8 Dampscale Basilisk Eyes to Arcanist Adyria in Shattrath City.^Our leader
column2: Voren'thal the Seer
column3: was once a close advisor to Kael'thas. His prophetic visions warned him that Kael's path would lead to the destruction of our race. The visions are usually vague and unfocused
column4: but our alchemists have devised an elixir to help him focus his clairvoyance. Unfortunately
column5: this elixir calls for a rare ingredient: basilisk eyes. My usual source
column6: this pathetic ethereal
column7: has failed me. Seek the dampscale basilisks in the rocky regions of Terokkar and bring me their eyes.

column1: Magical Disturbances^64^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Andarl^Andarl^^^^Andarl at the Allerian Stronghold wants you to kill 10 Warp Stalkers.^It's embarrassing to admit this
column2: but something has happened to me here in Terokkar Forest that hasn't occurred since my apprentice days. Occasionally
column3: my spells will fizzle when I know I've done everything correctly. I almost drove myself crazy the first time it happened. I think I've found the cause. The forest is full of creatures called warp stalkers
column4: demonic creatures with an affinity for magic and a habit of disturbing magical flows. The best way to deal with them is simply to kill them.

column1: Magical Disturbances^64^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Kurgatok^Kurgatok^^^^Kill 10 Warp Stalkers and return to Kurgatok at Stonebreaker Hold.^There's nothing more annoying than preparing to cast a spell
column2: only to have it interrupted by some unseen force. After the fourth time
column3: I knew it couldn't be coincidence and I sent Keb'ezil out to investigate. I guarantee you'll never encounter an imp that talks back more than Keb. Anyway
column4: he managed to find the source of the problem
column5: a pesky creature known as a warp stalker. They have a habit of disturbing the magical energy wherever they blink into existence. I've had enough of their interference.

column1: Vessels of Power^63^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Ros'eleth^Ros'eleth^Olemba Seeds^^^Bring 8 Draenei Vessels to Ros'eleth at the Allerian Stronghold.^Amid the ruins of Tuurem are a number of vessels containing raw
column2: magical energy. We are fortunate that the Broken who have overrun the city are ignorant to the resource in their midst
column3: but we cannot assume they will remain so forever. With those vessels and their power in hand
column4: the scattered survivors of my people can resist the lure of demonic magic. Every quel'dorei we can save from our prince's folly is one more that can help us regain our lost glory. Bring me these vessels
column5: <class>.

column1: Recover the Bones^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Soolaveen^Ramdor the Mad^Recover the Bones^The Tomb of Lights^^Collect 10 Restless Bones. Deliver them to Ramdor the Mad
column2: just off the western side of the Ring of Observance in Auchindoun
column3: which is in the middle of the Bone Wastes of Terokkar Forest.^The bones of the dead draenei litter the Bone Wastes from the explosion of Auchindoun. Their spirits are restless
column4: and cannot move on to the next life. <class>
column5: you must help me to recover their bones and take them to their final resting place! Only then will they be at peace; only then will they know comfort. Gather up the restless bones with care and deliver them to Ramdor the Mad at Auchindoun in the center of the Bone Wastes. Despite his name
column6: he will know how to care for them.

column1: Helping the Lost Find Their Way^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Ramdor the Mad^Soolaveen^Recover the Bones^^^Destroy 10 Lost Spirits and 10 Broken Skeletons
column2: and then speak with Soolaveen at the Refugee Caravan in the Bone Wastes of Terokkar Forest.^Many spirits of the draenei were corrupted by the explosion of Auchindoun. Now they wander the wastes in torment. <name>
column3: I beseech you to put them to rest. Destroy the lost spirits and broken skeletons that haunt the Bone Wastes beyond Auchindoun's walls. What? You think leaving them to wander in blind agony would be better? Afterward
column4: return to Soolaveen at the Refugee Caravan and tell him of that which you have done.

column1: Wanted: Bonelashers Dead!^65^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Wanted Poster^Taela Everstride^Wanted: Bonelashers Dead!^^^Kill 20 Bonelashers and then report to Taela Everstride at the Allerian Stronghold in Terokkar Forest.^A bounty is declared on the bonelashers of the Bone Wastes. As known carriers of the plague
column2: they are to be destroyed forthwith! While they can be found throughout the wastes
column3: they are known to congregate at Carrion Hill in the north. Report to Taela Everstride afterward to collect your reward.

column1: Wanted: Bonelashers Dead!^65^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Wanted Poster^Mawg Grimshot^Wanted: Bonelashers Dead!^^^Kill 20 Bonelashers and then report to Mawg Grimshot at Stonebreaker Hold in Terokkar Forest.^The bonelashers of the Bone Wastes bit Mawg and made him sick. Now he wants all of them destroyed! While they can be found throughout the wastes
column2: they are known to congregate at Carrion Hill in the north. Return to Mawg Grimshot after you've done the deed and he'll give you a good reward.

column1: Torgos!^65^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Taela Everstride^Taela Everstride^Wanted: Bonelashers Dead!^^^Call down Torgos with Trachela's Carcass. Acquire a Tail Feather of Torgos and return it to Taela Everstride at the Allerian Stronghold in Terokkar Forest.^There's a creature in the Bone Wastes so fearsome that only the dauntless dare to stalk him. I speak of Torgos
column2: king of the bonelashers
column3: who circles over Veil Rhaze on the western edge of the wastes. Too bad that there's an arakkoan scarecrow there
column4: known as Torgos's Bane
column5: which keeps him at bay. I'd bet if you laid his mate Trachela's carcass at the foot of that scarecrow he'd come down anyway. She can be found at Carrion Hill in the northern wastes. Bring me one of Torgos's tail feathers.

column1: Torgos!^65^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Mawg Grimshot^Mawg Grimshot^Wanted: Bonelashers Dead!^^^Call down Torgos with Trachela's Carcass. Acquire a Tail Feather of Torgos and return it to Mawg Grimshot at Stonebreaker Hold in Terokkar Forest.^I want Torgos
column2: king of the bonelashers
column3: dead! Not long ago
column4: while I was out hunting at Veil Rhaze on the western edge of the wastes
column5: he fell upon me. <Mawg taps his eyepatch.> He took my eye
column6: and now I would have his life! Bring me one of his tail feathers as proof and I'll give you a worthy reward. You'll need his mate Trachela's carcass though to call him down as he's deathly afraid of the old arakkoan scarecrow known as Torgos's Bane. Find her at Carrion Hill in the northern wastes.

column1: Rather Be Fishin'^64^All^Terokkar Forest^Seth^Seth^^^^Bring 8 Pristine Shimmerscale Eels to Seth in Shattrath City.^Speaking of lakes
column2: there's a lake with real good fishin' up to the northeast. I used to go up there with my friends
column3: but my mom won't let me go anymore. She says it's too dangerous
column4: but I haven't seen anything up there but a few little spiders. Like spiders can do anything to you... My favorites were always the eels that live up there. If you're going to be up by the lake
column5: would you think about bringing back some of the eels? They're feisty but once you subdue 'em
column6: you can bring 'em back no problem.

column1: Speak with Private Weeks^64^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Lieutenant Gravelhammer^Private Weeks^Speak with Private Weeks^^^Speak with Private Weeks near the north entrance to Grangol'var Village in Terokkar Forest.^A report's just come in from one of our scouts near Grangol'var Village. He says that a shadowy band has moved into the ruins there. <name>
column2: I want you to speak with Private Weeks and see how you can assist him to figure out what this unknown group is up to. Just head west past Stonebreaker Hold. His last report puts his position near the north entrance to the village.

column1: Speak with Scout Neftis^64^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Advisor Faila^Scout Neftis^Speak with Scout Neftis^^^Speak with Scout Neftis near the south entrance to Grangol'var Village in Terokkar Forest.^I am informed that one of our scouts near Grangol'var Village is currently observing a shadowy band that has recently moved in there. <name>
column2: I want you to speak with Scout Neftis and see how you can assist her in figuring out what this unknown group is up to. Just head south out of here
column3: and then due west
column4: skirting the north of the Bone Wastes. Her last report puts her position near the southern entrance to the village.

column1: Who Are They?^65^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Private Weeks^Private Weeks^Speak with Private Weeks^^^While in disguise
column2: speak with the Shadowy Initiate
column3: the Shadowy Laborer and the Shadowy Advisor. Then return to Private Weeks at Grangol'var Village in Terokkar Forest.^I don't know who they are
column4: but I know they're hostile! I'm going to give you a disguise
column5: and I want you to go in there and speak with three of them that I've observed as being 'chatty'. Talk with the initiate
column6: the laborer
column7: and the advisor. Just watch out; there're a few hunters in there who'll be able to see through your disguise and they look tough! And whatever you do
column8: don't leave the village -- the disguise is kind of flimsy. If you lose your disguise
column9: come back to me and I'll give you another.

column1: Who Are They?^65^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Scout Neftis^Scout Neftis^Speak with Scout Neftis^^^While in disguise
column2: speak with the Shadowy Initiate
column3: the Shadowy Laborer and the Shadowy Advisor. Then return to Scout Neftis at Grangol'var Village in Terokkar Forest.^I don't know who they are
column4: but I know they're hostile! I'm going to give you a disguise
column5: and I want you to go in there and speak with three of them that I've observed as being 'chatty'. Talk with the initiate
column6: the laborer
column7: and the advisor. Just watch out; there're a few hunters in there who'll be able to see through your disguise and they look tough! And whatever you do
column8: don't leave the village -- the disguise is kind of flimsy. If you lose your disguise
column9: come back to me and I'll give you another.

column1: Kill the Shadow Council!^65^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Private Weeks^Lieutenant Gravelhammer^Speak with Private Weeks^^^Kill 10 Shadowy Executioners
column2: 10 Shadowy Summoners and Shadowmaster Grieve
column3: and then return to Lieutenant Gravelhammer at the Allerian Stronghold in Terokkar Forest.^What! Those guys are Shadow Council?! <name>
column4: you have to go back in there and waste them! I want you to take out their leader and as many of their executioners and summoners as you can. After you're done with that
column5: report back to Lieutenant Gravelhammer at the Allerian Stronghold. Good luck
column6: <class>!

column1: Kill the Shadow Council!^65^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Scout Neftis^Advisor Faila^Speak with Scout Neftis^^^Kill 10 Shadowy Executioners
column2: 10 Shadowy Summoners and Shadowmaster Grieve
column3: and then return to Advisor Faila at Stonebreaker Hold in Terokkar Forest.^What! Those guys are Shadow Council?! <name>
column4: you have to go back in there and waste them! I want you to take out their leader and as many of their executioners and summoners as you can. After you're done with that
column5: report back to Advisor Faila at Stonebreaker Hold. Good luck
column6: <class>!

column1: A Visit With the Greatmother^68^Horde^Nagrand^Garrosh^Greatmother Geyah^A Visit With the Greatmother^The Totem of Kar'dash
column2: Message to Garadar
column3: Forge Camp: Annihilated^^Speak to Greatmother Geyah and listen to what she has to tell you.^The Greatmother has asked that I seek you out and deliver a message. She wishes to speak with you at once. My will has been sapped but make no mistake
column4: <name>
column5: if you anger the Greatmother
column6: I will come down upon you with all the force that I can muster. She is in the main hall. <Garrosh points at the large building to the north.> Listen to what she has to say and do as she tells you.

column1: Material Components^68^Horde^Nagrand^Greatmother Geyah^Greatmother Geyah^A Visit With the Greatmother^^^Greatmother Geyah at Garadar in Nagrand has asked that you collect 1 Olemba Root
column2: 1 Marshberry
column3: 1 Telaari Frond and 1 Dragonspine.^Mother Kashur wishes to speak with you
column4: <name>. Before this becomes possible
column5: you must collect the herbs required to create a potion that will expand your mind
column6: allowing you to commune with the spirits. You must gather Olemba root from Terokkar
column7: marshberries from Zangarmarsh
column8: Telaari fronds from Nagrand and dragonspine from the Blade's Edge mountains. I have written down instructions on this parchment as to the cultivation of these herbs. Return to me when you have gathered the materials.

column1: The Path of Glory^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Warp-Scryer Kryv^Warp-Scryer Kryv^The Path of Glory^^^Cleanse 8 Trampled Skeletons on the Path of Glory with Draenei Holy Water
column2: then return to Warp-Scryer Kryv at Honor Hold.^The 'Path of Glory
column3: ' they called it. A road leading from the heart of their gruesome fortress to the Dark Portal
column4: paved with the bones of my people. It wasn't enough for them to hunt us down like animals
column5: destroy our cities
column6: and torture those who survived. No
column7: they had to use our bones as paving stones
column8: denying my brethren a proper burial under the Light. Those tortured souls still wander these lands
column9: crying out for release. I ask you
column10: <name>
column11: help me in this undertaking.

column1: Unyielding Souls^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Honor Guard Wesilow^Honor Guard Wesilow^Unyielding Souls^Expedition Point^^Honor Guard Wesilow wants you to defeat 12 Unyielding Footmen
column2: 10 Unyielding Sorcerers
column3: and 5 Unyielding Knights at the Expedition Armory to the south.^Near the end of our invasion
column4: the Armory to the south fell under attack by the Horde's insidious Death Knights. Those vile shades cursed the Armory's defenders - and trapped their souls between the realms of the living and the dead. Those noble souls must be set free! I beg you
column5: <name>
column6: end my comrades' torment
column7: for I have not the heart to slay them myself.

column1: Escape from Firewing Point!^64^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Isla Starmane^Captain Auric Sunchaser^^^^Escort Isla Starmane to safety and then report to Captain Auric Sunchaser at the Allerian Stronghold in Terokkar Forest.^Thank goodness for you! <class>
column2: I need you to help me escape. I have information vital to the security of the Allerian Stronghold and probably all of Outland! I came here from the Cenarion Expedition on a diplomatic mission
column3: but as you can see
column4: they weren't very friendly. If you help me get to safety
column5: I can assure you that you will be handsomely rewarded! We won't be able to do this on our own - you do have a group with you
column6: right?

column1: Escape from Firewing Point!^64^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Isla Starmane^Advisor Faila^^^^Escort Isla Starmane to safety and then report to Advisor Faila at Stonebreaker Hold in Terokkar Forest.^Thank goodness for you! <class>
column2: I need you to help me escape. I have information vital to the security of Stonebreaker Hold and probably all of Outland! I came here from the Cenarion Expedition on a diplomatic mission
column3: but as you can see
column4: they weren't very friendly. If you help me get to safety
column5: I can assure you that you will be handsomely rewarded! We won't be able to do this on our own - you do have a group with you
column6: right?

column1: Waste Not
column2: Want Not^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Dumphry^Dumphry^Waste Not
column3: Want Not^^Laying Waste to the Unwanted^Bring 8 pieces of Salvaged Metal and 8 pieces of Salvaged Wood to Dumphry at Honor Hold.^Reinforcements are great
column4: but I don't see 'em haulin' any wagons loaded with ingots or timber. Take a look around
column5: friend. Trees are in short supply
column6: and the mines are overrun with Legion scum. I'm in a bad way fer supplies
column7: and I'm makin' what substitutions I can
column8: but it's time to start reusing what we can. The southern edge of the Path o' Glory is strewn with the ruins of siege machinery. Some pieces of 'em are still usable. Feeling up to a bit o' a salvage operation?

column1: Looking to the Leadership^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Honor Guard Wesilow^Honor Guard Wesilow^Unyielding Souls^^^Overcome the ghosts of Arch Mage Xintor and Lieutenant Commander Thalvos and return to Honor Guard Wesilow in the tower northwest of Honor Hold.^The disturbances at Expedition Armory continue
column2: despite your best efforts. No one truly knows everything that happened there
column3: nor exactly what binds the spirits of the fallen soldiers to the ruins. Perhaps we've been approaching this the wrong way. I've always assumed that each of the ghosts had a tie to the ruins
column4: but what if their ties were to their leaders? Arch Mage Xintor and Lieutenant Commander Thalvos were particularly close to their men
column5: so perhaps overcoming their ghosts will calm the rest.

column1: An Old Gift^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Father Malgor Devidicus^Father Malgor Devidicus^^^^Retrieve Mysteries of the Light and return it to Father Malgor Devidicus at Honor Hold.^<The priest's gaze slowly moves from his mug to you.> Don't you know better than to bother a man in his cups? Oh
column2: what's the use? I suppose newcomers are a good sign. What would Turalyon think? I remember the eve of our departure
column3: when I gave Mysteries of the Light to him. During the campaign and the ensuing years
column4: he never forgot to read his daily passage to the men. When he left us again
column5: he gave the book back to me. Like a fool
column6: I believed it safe in my quarters to the south of the armory.

column1: Explorers' League
column2: Is That Something for Gnomes?^17^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Prospector Nachlan^Clopper Wizbang^^^^Find Clopper Wizbang camped in an old turtle shell on the shore north of Blood Watch.^Babysitting! Would you believe it? They pulled me out of a promising dig and sent me along with Captain Odesyus' expedition to babysit that little gnome! I'd never heard o' a gnome wanting to become a prospector before
column3: so I asked. Seems we are takin' gnomes now
column4: and this particular one has a fascination with murlocs! Well
column5: he's gone off and set up shop in an old turtle shell on the northern shore of the island. Go and have a look if you don't believe me!

column1: Talk to the Hand^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Harbinger Mikolaas^Scout Jorli^^^^Report to Scout Jorli at Vindicator's Rest.^The Hand of Argus has established a forward base at Vindicator's Rest
column2: but they are sorely outnumbered by both the blood elves and mutated wildlife. Without backup
column3: their outpost is in danger of falling
column4: and we'd have no way to keep an eye on events near the Vector Coil. Report to Scout Jorli at Vindicator's Rest to the northwest and offer her your assistance
column5: <name>.

column1: Cutting a Path^17^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Scout Jorli^Scout Jorli^^^^Kill 10 Enraged Ravagers and return to Scout Jorli at Vindicator's Rest.^During our mission to reconnoiter the Sunhawks and their portal
column2: I sustained a serious wound. Scout Loryi has managed to staunch the bleeding and she's trying to figure out a way to evacuate me to Blood Watch. The problem is that we'd have to abandon our position here in order to guarantee a safe return. As soon as we leave this consecrated ground
column3: we'll be set upon by ravagers. If you can clear some of the enraged ravagers
column4: it might allow us to make the trip back safely.

column1: Oh
column2: the Tangled Webs They Weave^18^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Vindicator Corin^Vindicator Corin^^^^Kill 8 Mutated Tanglers and report to Vindicator Corin at Vindicator's Rest.^We don't dare abandon our post
column3: or wander too far from Vindicator's Rest
column4: <race>. The mutated creatures closest to the Vector Coil have been changed profoundly by energy leaking from the crystals. The mutated tanglers appear to have gained a certain degree of sentience. They've learned to create
column5: set
column6: and conceal vicious traps that can ensnare even the most careful warrior. We'll never be able to move against the Sunhawks if we're constantly forced to look underfoot. Attack the problem at its source
column7: <name>.

column1: Fouled Water Spirits^19^Alliance^Bloodmyst Isle^Vindicator Corin^Vindicator Corin^^^^Kill 6 Fouled Water Spirits and return to Vindicator Corin at Vindicator's Rest.^Most of the creatures touched by the crystals' energy have been corrupted in the same ways: strange marks on their flesh
column2: increased aggression
column3: and small crystal shards in their bodies. However
column4: the fouled water spirits north of here appear to be turning entirely to crystal. I've never seen anything react to the crystals this way before
column5: when we explored the foul pool
column6: they were particularly dangerous. We must get rid of them before the Sunhawks can exploit them as a new source of energy.

column1: Well Watcher Solanian^2^Horde^Mage^Julia Sunstriker^Well Watcher Solanian^^Mage Training^^Speak with Well Watcher Solanian at the Sunspire on Sunstrider Isle.^And now
column2: I need for you to do something. Well Watcher Solanian is in need of your services. You would do well to ingratiate yourself with him. He awaits you on the exterior platform that the ramp in this chamber leads up to.

column1: Well Watcher Solanian^2^Horde^Paladin^Jesthenis Sunstriker^Well Watcher Solanian^^Paladin Training^^Speak with Well Watcher Solanian at the Sunspire on Sunstrider Isle.^And now
column2: I need for you to do something. Well Watcher Solanian is in need of your services. You would do well to ingratiate yourself with him. He awaits you on the exterior platform that the ramp in this chamber leads up to.

column1: Well Watcher Solanian^2^Horde^Hunter^Ranger Sallina^Well Watcher Solanian^^Hunter Training^^Speak with Well Watcher Solanian at the Sunspire on Sunstrider Isle.^And now
column2: I need for you to do something. Well Watcher Solanian is in need of your services. You would do well to ingratiate yourself with him. He awaits you on the exterior platform that the ramp in this chamber leads up to.

column1: Well Watcher Solanian^2^Horde^Rogue^Pathstalker Kariel^Well Watcher Solanian^^Rogue Training^^Speak with Well Watcher Solanian at the Sunspire on Sunstrider Isle.^And now
column2: I need for you to do something. Well Watcher Solanian is in need of your services. You would do well to ingratiate yourself with him. He awaits you on the exterior platform that the ramp in this chamber leads up to.

column1: Well Watcher Solanian^2^Horde^Priest^Matron Arena^Well Watcher Solanian^^Priest Training^^Speak with Well Watcher Solanian at the Sunspire on Sunstrider Isle.^And now
column2: I need for you to do something. Well Watcher Solanian is in need of your services. You would do well to ingratiate yourself with him. He awaits you on the exterior platform that the ramp in this chamber leads up to.

column1: Well Watcher Solanian^2^Horde^Warlock^Summoner Teli'Larien^Well Watcher Solanian^^Warlock Training^^Speak with Well Watcher Solanian at the Sunspire on Sunstrider Isle.^And now
column2: I need for you to do something. Well Watcher Solanian is in need of your services. You would do well to ingratiate yourself with him. He awaits you on the exterior platform that the ramp in this chamber leads up to.

column1: Oshu'gun Crystal Powder^67^All^Nagrand^Chief Researcher Amereldine^Chief Researcher Amereldine^^^Oshu'gun Crystal Powder^Chief Researcher Amereldine at Halaa wants 10 Oshu'gun Crystal Powder Samples.^This base was the primary draenei research facility for the study of naaru crystals. What we have discovered is a veritable goldmine of research notes about the crystals from the "diamond" mountain
column2: Oshu'gun. It would seem that everything in this region carries with it some residual powder of the Oshu'gun crystals. If you find any powder while adventuring in this region
column3: return it to me and I shall reward you with a token of my appreciation which you may use to make purchases from the quartermaster.

column1: Oshu'gun Crystal Powder^67^All^Nagrand^Chief Researcher Kartos^Chief Researcher Kartos^^^Oshu'gun Crystal Powder^Chief Researcher Kartos at Halaa wants 10 Oshu'gun Crystal Powder Samples.^This base was the primary draenei research facility for the study of naaru crystals. What we have discovered is a veritable goldmine of research notes about the crystals from the "diamond" mountain
column2: Oshu'gun. It would seem that everything in this region carries with it some residual powder of the Oshu'gun crystals. If you find any powder while adventuring in this region
column3: return it to me and I shall reward you with a token of my appreciation which you may use to make purchases from the quartermaster.

column1: Laying Waste to the Unwanted^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Dumphry^Dumphry^Waste Not
column2: Want Not^^^Use the Flaming Torch to burn the Horde Blade Throwers overlooking the Path of Glory. Then
column3: bring the Flaming Torch to Dumphry in Honor Hold.^Now that we've gotten our salvage operation off the ground
column4: it's time to begin the second phase of the plan. Across the Path of Glory
column5: the Horde still has their old blade throwers trained on us. Don't let their age fool you
column6: <name>
column7: they're still very dangerous. Much as we're working to reclaim what we can
column8: we can't assume the Horde is going to dismantle their weaponry. Take this torch and burn the remaining siege equipment. I'll take no chances with Honor Hold's safety.

column1: When This Mine's a-Rockin'^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Foreman Biggums^Foreman Biggums^When This Mine's a-Rockin'^The Path of Anguish^^Kill 12 Gan'arg Sappers and return to Foreman Biggums.^The mine's been overrun by a plague of gan'arg misfits! Not only did they run all my workers out of the tunnels
column2: but they're pounding away in there night and day! To make things worse
column3: now I've got Danath on me back! He says he's going to take away me ale ration if I don't get this taken care of soon! None of the miners'll go in there
column4: and the guards are busy drinking themselves silly. I'm begging you
column5: <name>
column6: help me here. Danath can take me dignity
column7: but he'll never take me ale!

column1: To Meet Mother Kashur^68^Horde^Nagrand^Greatmother Geyah^Mother Kashur^A Visit With the Greatmother^^^Greatmother Geyah wants you to speak with Mother Kashur.^Do not be alarmed by what you might see once the effect has taken hold! These spirits are all around us - always. The potion allows your mind to be able to understand and ultimately see the spirits. You will need to be under its influence if you are to speak with Mother Kashur. You will find her a great ways to the southwest
column2: at the Ancestral Grounds.

column1: The Agitated Ancestors^68^Horde^Nagrand^Mother Kashur^Mother Kashur^A Visit With the Greatmother^^^Mother Kashur has asked that you put to rest 8 Agitated Orc Spirits.^Do you see them walking around us? The Ancestral Grounds are normally quiet and undisturbed. As of late
column2: the ancestral spirits have risen and are extremely agitated. Something is causing a great disturbance to the spirits. We must discover what that something could be
column3: but first
column4: we must put the immediate threat to rest. These ghosts that you see walking about are not truly the ancestors but a representation of their state of being. You must destroy the agitated orc spirits. Do this and return to me.

column1: A Visit With The Ancestors^68^Horde^Nagrand^Mother Kashur^Mother Kashur^A Visit With the Greatmother^^^Mother Kashur at the Ancestral Grounds in Nagrand has asked that you Visit Sunspring Post
column2: Visit Laughing Skull Ruins
column3: Visit Garadar and Visit Bleeding Hollow Ruins.^I need for you to journey to the villages of the ancestors
column4: <name>. Seek each one out and see if the ancestors remain. Visit Sunspring Post to the north
column5: visit the Laughing Skull Ruins far to the north against the mountains
column6: visit Garadar to the northeast
column7: and finally
column8: visit the Bleeding Hollow Ruins on the borders of Nagrand and the Terokkar Forest
column9: to the east. Return to me once you have observed the ancestors in their homes.

column1: I Work... For the Horde!^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Megzeg Nukklebust^Megzeg Nukklebust^I Work... For the Horde!^^^Bring 8 pieces of Salvaged Metal and 8 pieces of Salvaged Wood to Megzeg Nukklebust in Thrallmar.^Would you believe it? These orcs hired me to help them shore up damaged fortifications and build explosives. What a dream job! It's too bad we're so short on materials
column2: but a clever goblin like myself learns how to make do! Can you help me? I need salvaged wood and metal from the ruined battlements along the Path of Glory. Go down there and salvage
column3: and watch out for those red-skinned orcs! When you're done
column4: come back for big rewards!

column1: Burn It Up... For the Horde!^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Megzeg Nukklebust^Megzeg Nukklebust^I Work... For the Horde!^^^Use the Flaming Torch to burn the Eastern Alliance Cannon and the Western Alliance Cannon
column2: and then return to Megzeg Nukklebust in Thrallmar.^I'm a lucky
column3: lucky goblin. I get to make explosives and killing machines
column4: knowing they'll be used immediately on important missions! Speaking of missions
column5: I just got one from Thrallmar command: burn the Alliance cannons on the far side of the Path of Glory... the ones pointing dangerously close to Horde fortifications. Take this torch and make your way to each cannon. Fire the torch and watch the sparks fly!

column1: The Soul Devices^70^All^Shattrath City^Spy To'gun^Spymistress Mehlisah Highcrown^Find Spy To'gun^^^Steal 5 Soul Devices and deliver them to Spymistress Mehlisah Highcrown at the Terrace of the Light in Shattrath City.^Gah! They've been torturing me
column2: trying to get me to tell them everything that I know. I failed - they fed the others to Hellmaw
column3: and I was to be next. But I told them nothing! They're crazy! They're hell-bent on summoning demonic forces that they have no way of controlling! They're using special devices to make their soul shards
column4: and their summoning
column5: more powerful. You must steal these devices! I would join you
column6: but I must return to Shattrath City to report to the Lower City's spymistress.

column1: The Temple of Telhamat^63^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Warp-Scryer Kryv^Amaan the Wise^The Path of Glory^^^Speak with Amaan the Wise at the Temple of Telhamat in western Hellfire Peninsula.^Fortunately
column2: the Path of Glory is not the only trace of my people in these lands. To the west
column3: a few of our holy sites survive
column4: although some have been overrun. While Velen prepared for the journey that would lead him to Azeroth
column5: those of us who would remain behind sought to reestablish a presence at our holy places. In the western part of the Hellfire Peninsula
column6: you will find a small group of draenei at the Temple of Telhamat
column7: led by Amaan the Wise. I am certain he'd be interested in meeting you.

column1: The Codex of Blood^70^All^Lower City^Field Commander Mahfuun^The Codex of Blood^Trouble at Auchindoun^^^Read from the Codex of Blood in the Shadow Labyrinth of Auchindoun.^It has been two years since the Shadow Council summoning that resulted in the explosion of this once-great mausoleum
column2: and the formation of the Bone Wastes. Now they are at war with an unbelievably powerful force on the inside. <name>
column3: you must make your way into the Shadow Labyrinth to determine what they are up against
column4: and to see if it poses a threat to us. Our spies speak of their use of a forbidden book of unholy summoning
column5: known only as the Codex of Blood. Seek your answers within its pages.

column1: Into the Heart of the Labyrinth^70^All^Shattrath City^The Codex of Blood^Spymistress Mehlisah Highcrown^Trouble at Auchindoun^^^Destroy Murmur and inform Spymistress Mehlisah Highcrown at the Terrace of Light in Shattrath City of the events that have transpired inside the Shadow Labyrinth.^The Shadow Council has lost control of the cosmic being that they summoned here almost two years ago! It is what caused the explosion of Auchindoun
column2: and the creation of the Bone Wastes beyond. Known only as Murmur
column3: it threatens to overrun the Shadow Council and break free into the outside world! With the grandmaster
column4: and the rest of their leadership dead
column5: you are Outland's last hope against this monstrosity! <name>
column6: you know at the core of your being that you and your companions dare not fail!

column1: Saving the Sporeloks^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Lauranna Thar'well^Lauranna Thar'well^^The Umbrafen Tribe^^Slay 10 Marsh Dredgers and 10 Marsh Lurkers
column2: and then return to Lauranna Thar'well at the Cenarion Refuge in Zangarmarsh.^Ikeyen's been telling me stories about what happened to him down in those caves and I think it's just awful! You know
column3: maybe we should do something to help out those poor sporeloks. Ikeyen says that they live there in the Funggor Cavern
column4: but that the marsh beasts have recently invaded. Why don't you go down there and see if you can clear some of those marsh beasts out? It's just to the southwest.

column1: Brother Against Brother^69^All^Terokkar Forest^Isfar^Isfar^^^^Kill Darkweaver Syth in the Sethekk halls
column2: then free Lakka from captivity. Return to Isfar outside the Sethekk Halls when you've completed the rescue.^The Sethekk departed Skettis with great fanfare when Auchindoun exploded. Surely it must've been an omen of our master's arrival. My brother
column3: Syth
column4: was one of their leaders and told us we were obligated to go into the temple ruins and face our god. After we took up residence in the ruins
column5: calling them the Sethekk Halls
column6: I began to doubt my brother and his ally
column7: Ikiss. In time
column8: Syth had me cast out of the Halls
column9: but he refused to let me take our sister Lakka with me. Will you help me rescue her?

column1: Terokk's Legacy^69^All^Terokkar Forest^Isfar^Isfar^^^^Bring Terokk's Mask
column2: Terokk's Quill
column3: and the Saga of Terokk to Isfar outside the Sethekk Halls.^My people honor an ancient hero named Terokk. Arakkoa hatchlings are regaled with stories of his deeds and descriptions of his beautiful plumage. He dwelt among my people for hundreds of years
column4: but mysteriously vanished one day
column5: leaving only his mask
column6: spear
column7: and writings behind. The relics are cherished by the arakkoa
column8: but they were heartbroken when the Sethekk bore the objects away from Skettis at their departure. I have written down what little I know about their location within the halls.

column1: The Mastermind^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Foreman Biggums^Foreman Biggums^When This Mine's a-Rockin'^^^Locate and kill Z'kral in the mines beneath Honor Hold
column2: then report back to Foreman Biggums.^Those infernal gan'arg keep scurrying into the mine! For each one you kill
column3: two or three more seem to take its place! There's got to be someone down there in the deepest reaches of the mine directing the incursion. You seemed to do well against them last time
column4: and Light knows you're the only one brave enough to venture back into the mine. Find out who's responsible for this disturbance and make him pay!

column1: When Spirits Speak^68^Horde^Nagrand^Mother Kashur^K'ure^A Visit With the Greatmother^^^Mother Kashur at the Ancestral Grounds in Nagrand has asked that you seek out the vision you had. Find K'ure in Oshu'gun.^Oshu'gun - the diamond mountain - was once sacred to my people. It was there that the clans would gather every year to celebrate the springtime festival. It was there that our shaman communed with the honored ancestors. It was the center of our culture - until the shadows overtook us. When the clans became a horde
column2: the spirits of Oshu'gun fell silent. The ancestors turned their backs on us. Yet something now draws them from their rest. Venture to Oshu'gun and discover what could trouble the spirits so.

column1: A Secret Revealed^68^Horde^Nagrand^K'ure^A'dal^A Visit With the Greatmother^^^Speak with A'dal in Shattrath City.^As my energies bled away over the centuries
column2: a void slowly grew in my place - devouring the souls of those nearby. Helplessly
column3: I watched as generations of orc souls were drawn into the vortex. Recently
column4: my enemies harnessed the vortex and used it to draw countless void minions into their Burning Legion. Now
column5: the key to ending this cycle and freeing the orc spirits lies with another naaru - A'dal. I have sensed his essence within the ancient city of Shattrath in the Terokkar Forest.

column1: Report to Zurai^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Ranger Captain Venn'ren^Zurai^^^^Report to Zurai at Swamprat Post in Zangarmarsh.^With the arrival of Field Commander Romus and his forces
column2: the Alliance and their draenei friends have grown bold. They're militarizing every old draenei ruin from here to Shattrath. In response
column3: the trolls have established a new outpost in the eastern part of Zangarmarsh
column4: just south of the Dead Mire. Swamprat Post
column5: they're calling it. I'm glad they have a sense of humor about living in a place like that
column6: because I wouldn't relish it. The post's commander has asked me to send anyone I can spare.

column1: Concerns About Tuurem^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Ikuti^Andarl^^^^Speak with Andarl at the Allerian Stronghold in Terokkar Forest.^The rumors from Tuurem are unsettling. Some say the town's ruins are overrun with crazed Broken and Lost Ones
column2: while opportunistic artifact hunters steal draenei relics. It's hard to know which are true and which aren't
column3: but we have a responsibility to safeguard the ruins as best we can. Find Andarl at the Allerian Stronghold in Terokkar Forest. He is something of a student of magical relics. More than anyone else
column4: he's likely to know what's going on there.

column1: News for Rakoria^62^All^Zangarmarsh^Shadow Hunter Denjai^Rakoria^^^^Speak with Rakoria at Stonebreaker Hold in Terokkar Forest.^Now that Swamprat Post is complete
column2: our control of the roads in and out of the marsh is much less tenuous. Our presence in Terokkar Forest is much less secure. Even so
column3: at Stonebreaker Hold
column4: Rakoria awaits word of our progress. She's sharp and capable
column5: <name>
column6: but be careful around her. She's got a lot of goods she's eager to move along the roads
column7: but don't assume she's got our best interests at heart. Rakoria goes where she believes there's profit to be found.

column1: Hellfire Fortifications^60^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Warrant Officer Tracy Proudwell^Warrant Officer Tracy Proudwell^^^^Capture the Overlook
column2: the Stadium and Broken Hill
column3: then return to Warrant Officer Tracy Proudwell in Honor Hold in Hellfire Peninsula.^The Hellfire Citadel wages constant battles with our forces. We are holding our own so far
column4: but we can't yet launch a real offensive against them. To do that
column5: we need forward staging areas. Our scouts identified three fortifications near Hellfire Citadel. We want you to help secure these forts. Capture each fort
column6: and then report back to me. May fortune shine upon you in the conflicts ahead
column7: <name>
column8: for you will no doubt clash with Horde forces eager to gain these same fortifications.

column1: Diplomatic Measures^66^Horde^Nagrand^Jorin Deadeye^Lantresor of the Blade^The Impotent Leader^^Ruthless Cunning
column2: Armaments for Deception^Jorin Deadeye at Garadar in Nagrand has asked that you find and speak with Lantresor of the Blade in the Burning Blade Ruins.^Kilrath sends news of the Boulderfist leader: He is an orc! An ancient orc that passed through the Dark Portal in the time of our fathers and has since returned to his homeland. I wish for you to track down this orc and try to convince him to pull back the Boulderfist ogres. He resides on an upper platform in the Burning Blade Ruins to the southeast near the border of Terokkar. Good luck
column3: <name>! Be warned
column4: he is a blademaster...

column1: Diplomatic Measures^66^Alliance^Nagrand^Mo'mor the Breaker^Lantresor of the Blade^Do My Eyes Deceive Me^^Ruthless Cunning
column2: Armaments for Deception^Mo'mor the Breaker at Telaar in Nagrand has asked that you find and speak with Lantresor of the Blade in the Burning Blade Ruins.^The huntress's agents send news of the Boulderfist leader: He is an orc! An ancient orc that passed through the Dark Portal in the time of our fathers and has since returned to his homeland. I wish for you to track down this orc and try to convince him to pull back the Boulderfist ogres. He resides on an upper platform in the Burning Blade Ruins to the east. Good luck
column3: <name>! Be warned
column4: he is a blademaster...

column1: I Must Have Them!^66^All^Nagrand^Wazat^Wazat^I Must Have Them!^^^Wazat across from Clan Watch in southern Nagrand wants you to bring him 3 Air Elemental Gases.^Do you see them?? By Gazlowe's horrific halitosis
column2: I will have those eggs! Say
column3: you look like you might be of some use. I'll tell you what
column4: <race>; if you gather a few items for me to make my Jump-a-tron 4000 functional
column5: I'll give you a key that will let you operate the machine as well! What can you do with a Jump-a-tron 4000 you say? What can't you do is more like it... I'll need air elemental gas from the air elementals of Nagrand. They're all over the place so don't ask me where to find 'em!

column1: Hellfire Fortifications^60^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Battlecryer Blackeye^Battlecryer Blackeye^^^^Capture the Overlook
column2: the Stadium and Broken Hill
column3: then return to Battlecryer Blackeye in Thrallmar.^The fel orcs of Hellfire Citadel must be scoured from our birthland! To attack them
column4: we must first secure forward staging points near the Citadel. Our outrunners found three fortifications that will suit this purpose
column5: but the Alliance has the same idea and even now sends forces to take them! We want you to stop the Alliance and capture these forts. Aid in the capture of each fort and then return to me. For the Horde!

column1: Bring Me The Egg!^66^All^Nagrand^Wazat^Wazat^I Must Have Them!^^^Wazat in Nagrand wants you to use the Jump-a-tron 4000 to get to the nest in the nearby tree and steal the Mysterious Egg.^Now that you've been initiated
column2: I want you to get me that egg! Use the Jump-a-tron and try to hit the nest dead center. But be careful! Bodily injury or serious permanent damage may occur from a bad jump.
