column1: A Personal Favor^64^All^Terokkar Forest^Wind Trader Lathrai^Wind Trader Lathrai^By Any Means Necessary^^^Retrieve 5 of Lathrai's Stolen Goods. Return them to Wind Trader Lathrai near the World's End Tavern in the Lower City section of Shattrath City.^Hmmm? A box you say? Or was it several? Do you know what material the box was constructed from? And what was the name of this merchant? Empoor? Are you certain that he's one of the Broken? I don't do much business with their kind. Perhaps my memory would be jogged if you were to do me a favor? The Skithian arakkoa - primitive casters that they are - recently stole a huge shipment of my more exotic goods. I want it all back! You can find Veil Skith just to the south of Shattrath City.

The Nesingwary Safari^65^Alliance^Nagrand^"Shotgun" Jones^Hemet Nesingwary^^^^"Shotgun" Jones wants you to speak with Hemet Nesingwary at the Nesingwary Safari on the outskirts of northeast Nagrand.^"Go out and find us some supplies
column2: he said. I was nearly killed about 15 times before I found this place! These Broken might not be the most hospitable bunch but at least they're not trying to tear my skin from my bones. Anyway, I'm not going back. My days of huntin' big game are over. If you end up heading northeast towards Zangarmarsh and run into the Nesingwary Safari, let them know that Shotgun" quit. Hey
column3: maybe you can take my place! Good luck
column4: stranger.

column1: The Nesingwary Safari^65^Horde^Nagrand^Ohlorn Farstrider^Shado 'Fitz' Farstrider^^^^Ohlorn Farstrider wants you to speak with Shado 'Fitz' Farstrider at the Nesingwary Safari in Nagrand.^These orcs have never seen a tauren before - if you can believe such a thing. If it weren't for Captain Kroghan
column2: they would have probably been serving me for their next meal right about now. But where are my manners? I am Ohlorn Farstrider
column3: hunter extraordinaire! I am part of the Nesingwary expedition that came up here from Azeroth in search of big game. If you are interested in the hunt
column4: perhaps you should visit my crew at the Nesingwary Safari
column5: due east of here near the border of Zangarmarsh.

column1: Daggerfen Deviance^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Ikuti^Ikuti^^^^Slay 3 Daggerfen Assassins and 15 Daggerfen Muckdwellers.^The Kurenai and the draenei don't always see eye to eye
column2: particularly on the issue of the Lost Ones. We are content to help the Lost Ones who seek us out
column3: but we won't pursue them. Some draenei are intent on 'redeeming' them all. However
column4: there are times when even the Lost Ones go too far
column5: such as the Daggerfen. In their village to the west
column6: they dabble in poisons and deceit
column7: arts that come unnaturally to us. We must put an end to this before the vile Daggerfen can extend their influence.

column1: Wanted: Chieftain Mummaki^64^Alliance^Zangarmarsh^Wanted Poster^Ikuti^^^^Bring Chieftain Mummaki's Totem to Ikuti at the Orebor Harborage.^Wanted: Chieftain Mummaki - leader of the foul and degenerate Lost One tribe of the Daggerfen
column2: for his brutal attacks against the Orebor Harborage. The chieftain and his band of assassins are responsible for the deaths of numerous Kurenai and draenei and should only be approached by seasoned combatants. Travelers are advised to avoid the Daggerfen Village area to the west of the Orebor Harborage. To claim the bounty
column3: present proof of the chietain's demise to Ikuti.

column1: Wanted: Chieftain Mummaki^64^Horde^Zangarmarsh^Wanted Poster^Shadow Hunter Denjai^^^^Bring Chieftain Mummaki's Totem to Shadow Hunter Denjai.^Wanted: Chieftain Mummaki - leader of the foul and degenerate Lost One tribe of the Daggerfen
column2: for his brutal attacks against Zabra'jin and its inhabitants. The chieftain and his band of assassins are responsible for the deaths of numerous scouts and messengers and should only be approached by seasoned combatants. Travelers are advised to avoid the Daggerfen Village area to the northwest of Zabra'jin. To claim the bounty
column3: present proof of the chietain's demise to Shadow Hunter Denjai.

column1: Message to the Daggerfen^64^All^Zangarmarsh^Shadow Hunter Denjai^Shadow Hunter Denjai^^Impending Attack^^Slay 3 Daggerfen Assassins and 15 Daggerfen Muckdwellers and return to Shadow Hunter Denjai at Zabra'jin.^Of all the Lost One tribes in Zangarmarsh
column2: the Daggerfen are the most cunning and most aggressive. They are highly organized and make no secret of the fact that they desire control over the other Lost Ones in the marsh. Their attacks have already taken quite a toll on my scouts and messengers. I cannot afford to lose any more men. If we don't act soon
column3: they'll have complete control over the roads and Zabra'jin will effectively be surrounded.

column1: Through the Dark Portal^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Watch Commander Relthorn Netherwane^Commander Duron^Through the Dark Portal^^^Travel through the Dark Portal and find Commander Duron. He awaits your arrival on the other side - in the Outland.^For 20 years the Dark Portal has remained a silent monument - a eulogy to a time long since forgotten. <Relthorn looks around.> I never thought to see this day
column2: yet here we stand
column3: looking into the abyss. On the other side of this gate we are locked in a savage war - a war that we cannot win without support. You must go through the Dark Portal and help our troops
column4: <class>. Report to Commander Duron at once. He awaits you in Outland...

column1: Arrival in Outland^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Lieutenant General Orion^Vlagga Freyfeather^Through the Dark Portal^^^Lieutenant General Orion at the Dark Portal in Hellfire Peninsula wants you to bring Orion's Report to Vlagga Freyfeather.^Aided by the Alliance
column2: my forces will hold the line here
column3: but I need you to deliver my report to General Krakork in Thrallmar. With his help
column4: we'll be able to drive these demons back into the abyss that spawned them! Speak to Vlagga Freyfeather who stands on the platform behind us. She'll speed you on your way.

column1: Eradicate the Burning Legion^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Nazgrel^Sergeant Shatterskull^Through the Dark Portal^^^Speak with Sergeant Shatterskull at the Supply Caravan just outside of Thrallmar
column2: to the east.^Though this land is full of strange new enemies
column3: the Burning Legion is still the greatest threat to our Expedition. One of my most trusted warriors
column4: Sergeant Shatterskull
column5: has been studying the Legion's tactics - trying to discern the demons' true purpose in this land. Seek him out at the supply caravan just outside the southern wall. And <name> - be wary of the Legion. Their evil cannot be underestimated.

column1: Felspark Ravine^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Sergeant Shatterskull^Sergeant Shatterskull^Through the Dark Portal^^Hellfire Fortifications
column2: Hellfire Fortifications^Sergeant Shatterskull at the Supply Caravan east of Thrallmar in Hellfire Peninsula wants you to kill 4 Flamewaker Imps
column3: 6 Infernal Warbringers and 1 Dreadcaller.^Doom Lord Kazzak commands the Burning Legion in Outland. While we can't get to Kazzak - yet - we can and must get to his lieutenants that command Legion troops from the ground. They have stationed dreadlords in Felspark Ravine
column4: east of here. They are responsible for these infernal storms that rain down upon our heads. To take them and their minions out would be a great set back to the Burning Legion.

column1: Forward Base: Reaver's Fall^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Sergeant Shatterskull^Forward Commander To'arch^Through the Dark Portal^^Weaken the Ramparts^Report to Forward Commander To'arch at Reaver's Fall.^Your battle prowess has been noted by high command
column2: <class>. They want to send you to the front lines to meet up with Maimfist's crew. They're radicals
column3: devoted to the complete extermination of the Burning Legion
column4: so you may fit right in... Head east about 200 paces and veer south at the jutting mass of land. You'll see Reaver's Fall where an old farm used to stand. Once there
column5: you are to report to Foward Commander To'arch. Now move out!

column1: Mission: Gateways Murketh and Shaadraz^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Forward Commander To'arch^Forward Commander To'arch^Through the Dark Portal^^^Speak with Wing Commander Brack
column2: bomb Gateway Murketh and Gateway Shaadraz and then return to Forward Commander To'arch at Reaver's Fall.^We've identified the two main transporters that the Burning Legion are using to bring in reinforcements: Gateway Murketh and Gateway Shaadraz. If you look east up the Path of Glory
column3: you'll see them on either side of the road. I want you to bomb them both into oblivion! Here are the bombs you'll use
column4: specially designed by a goblin in Area 52. Now
column5: speak with Wing Commander Brack -- he'll put you on a wyvern.

column1: Colossal Menace^63^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Tola'thion^Tola'thion^^^^Slay 5 Raging Colossi and then return to Tola'thion at the Cenarion Post in Hellfire Peninsula.^You see that huge red crystal to the north? It fell from the sky not long ago
column2: causing a massive earthquake. When we came out here to investigate the disturbance
column3: we found all of these colossi wandering about that weren't previously here. There's definitely something strange about that crystal and the energies that it's emanating
column4: but I don't have time for that. Those mountain giants are my immediate concern. I want you to head up to Fallen Sky Ridge with some friends and deal with them.

column1: Crimson Crystal Clue^63^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Crimson Crystal Shard^Tola'thion^Crimson Crystal Clue^^^Deliver the Crimson Crystal Shard to Tola'thion at the Cenarion Post in Hellfire Peninsula.^As the colossus falls under the weight of your attacks
column2: you notice for the first time that it was holding a red crystal fragment. While it was small and unnoticeable in the mountain giant's hand
column3: it's a fairly hefty piece for you to carry around. It also suspiciously looks like it's a piece of the giant crystal in the middle of the ridge. It's most definitely a clue as to the strangeness that is occurring here
column4: and you're sure that the druids at the Cenarion Post to the south will want to see it.

column1: Cruel's Intentions^63^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Nazgrel^Nazgrel^Mission: Kill the Messenger^Doorway to the Abyss^^Kill Arazzius the Cruel
column2: then return to Nazgrel in Thrallmar.^Magister Bloodhawk finally deciphered the Legion missive you found earlier. It turned out to be attack plans sent by one of Highlord Kazzak's lieutenants - Arazzius the Cruel. Apparently
column3: Arazzius commands the Legion ground forces in Hellfire. The time has come to terminate his command
column4: <name>. Terminate with extreme prejudice. Head west to the Pools of Aggonar and put an end to this so-called 'Legion lord'. Today
column5: the Horde reclaims Hellfire Peninsula. Let the Legion be damned.

column1: Journey to Honor Hold^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Amish Wildhammer^Marshal Isildor^Through the Dark Portal^^^Take a flight to Honor Hold and deliver Duron's Report to Marshal Isildor.^When you're ready
column2: I'll arrange a flight straight to Honor Hold. From there
column3: speak with Marshal Isildor and give him Duron's report. He'll be happy to see another recruit from the homelands
column4: and I'm sure the information in that report is important stuff!

column1: The Legion Reborn^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Force Commander Danath Trollbane^Sergeant Altumus^The Legion Reborn^Force Commander Danath^^Speak with Sergeant Altumus at the East Supply Caravan just outside of Honor Hold
column2: to the east.^While the Burning Legion invaded Azeroth
column3: they were also at work here
column4: in Outland. We have tracked their movements over the years
column5: but this latest activity
column6: <class> - well
column7: this is beyond anything we've seen. Seek out Sergeant Altumus near the eastern supply caravan. She has been monitoring the invaders and may have insights into their purpose. Be swift - and take care
column8: <name> - the Burning Legion is not to be underestimated.

column1: The Path of Anguish^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Sergeant Altumus^Sergeant Altumus^The Legion Reborn^^A Job for an Intelligent Man
column2: When This Mine's a-Rockin'^Sergeant Altumus at the East Supply Caravan east of Honor Hold in Hellfire Peninsula wants you to kill 4 Flamewaker Imps
column3: 6 Infernal Warbringers and 1 Dreadcaller.^Doom Lord Kazzak commands the Burning Legion in Outland. While we can't get to Kazzak - yet - we can and must get to his lieutenants that command Legion troops from the ground. They have stationed dreadlords at the Path of Anguish
column4: east of here. They are the ones responsible for these infernal storms that rain down upon our heads. To take them and their minions out would be a great set back to the Burning Legion.

column1: Expedition Point^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Sergeant Altumus^Forward Commander Kingston^The Legion Reborn^^The Longbeards
column2: Weaken the Ramparts
column3: Unyielding Souls
column4: Hellfire Fortifications
column5: Hellfire Fortifications^Report to Forward Commander Kingston at Expedition Point.^Your battle prowess has been noted by high command
column6: <class>. They want to send you to the front lines to meet up with Rohamus's crew. They're radicals
column7: devoted to the complete extermination of the Burning Legion
column8: so you may fit right in... Head east about 400 paces
column9: across the Valley of Bones
column10: until you run into a destroyed fel reaver. You'll see Expedition Point where a Legion base used to stand. Once there
column11: you are to report to Forward Commander Kingston. Now move out!

column1: Disrupt Their Reinforcements^62^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Forward Commander Kingston^Forward Commander Kingston^The Legion Reborn^^Mission: The Murketh and Shaadraz Gatewa^Defeat enemies around Portal Grimh and Portal Kaalez to gather Demonic Rune Stones.^You'll find the Legion front to our northeast
column2: and spaced along it are portals used to gather reinforcements from throughout Outland. We
column3: <name>
column4: are going to destroy those portals! Take this primer. Designed in Area 52
column5: it uses the demons' own power as an explosive device! Defeat Legion forces around Portals Grimh and Kaalez to gather demonic rune stones
column6: use the primer to detonate the stones inside the portals... then watch the fireworks!! Go
column7: <name>
column8: and return to me when your mission is complete.

column1: Mission: The Murketh and Shaadraz Gateways^62^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Forward Commander Kingston^Forward Commander Kingston^Mission: The Murketh and Shaadraz Gateways^Disrupt Their Reinforcements^^Speak with Wing Commander Dabir'ee
column2: bomb Gateway Murketh and Gateway Shaadraz and then return to Forward Commander Kingston at Expedition Point.^Just west of the Dark Portal are two huge transporters: Gateway Murketh and Gateway Shaadraz. If you look east up the Path of Glory
column3: you'll see them on either side of the road. I want you to bomb them both into rubble! Here are the bombs you'll use
column4: specially designed by a goblin in Area 52. Now
column5: speak with Wing Commander Dabir'ee -- he'll put you on a gryphon and send you on your way.

column1: Keep Thornfang Hill Clear!^63^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Mahuram Stouthoof^Mahuram Stouthoof^^^^Kill 8 Thornfang Ravagers and 8 Thornfang Venomspitters
column2: and then return to Mahuram Stouthoof at the Cenarion Post in Hellfire Peninsula.^We've been fighting an ongoing battle to keep the pass through Thornfang Hill to the west clear of ravagers. It would be bad if we were to become completely cut off from the refuge in Zangarmarsh. We don't want to displace the creatures
column3: but there seems to be little choice as their attacks on travelers through the area have become more aggressive. Clear some of the ravagers out of there if you can.

column1: Know your Enemy^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Force Commander Danath Trollbane^Lieutenant Amadi^Know your Enemy^Force Commander Danath^^Speak with Lieutenant Amadi at the old guard tower just west of Honor Hold.^Rumors have surfaced that some new breed of orc is on the rise. Larger
column2: meaner - more cunning than the brutes we're familiar with. If these rumors are true then our forces
column3: already stretched
column4: may be taxed beyond their limit. I have entrusted my lieutenant
column5: Amadi
column6: with investigating this matter. If you would help us in this dark hour
column7: seek her out. She is stationed at the broken tower just west of the Hold. And <name> - be careful out there. You're heading into a dangerous new world.

column1: In Case of Emergency...^61^All^Hellfire Peninsula^"Screaming" Screed Luckheed^"Screaming" Screed Luckheed^In Case of Emergency...^^Voidwalkers Gone Wild^Collect 30 pieces of Zeppelin Debris and bring them to "Screaming" Screed Luckheed at the Zeppelin Crash.^In the event of an emergency
column2: it's always the pilot's job to keep a level head
column3: especially when the only orders your co-pilot follows come from his stomach. The good news is that we won't need to wait days for replacement parts to be imported. The bad news is that the "spare" parts got scattered from here to the Valley of Bones to the east. The other bad news? The spare parts aren't so spare. They
column4: uh
column5: fell off during our rapid descent. Could you help me collect enough to get us off the ground again?

column1: Mission: The Abyssal Shelf^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Forward Commander To'arch^Forward Commander To'arch^Through the Dark Portal^^Return to the Abyssal Shelf
column2: Return to Thrallmar^Forward Commander To'arch at Reaver's Fall in Hellfire Peninsula has asked that you destroy 20 Gan'arg Peons
column3: 5 Mo'arg Overseers and 5 Fel Cannons.^Now that you've got your wings
column4: perhaps you'd be interested in running another bombing mission? This time we've isolated the Legion's main production area
column5: behind the forge camps to the north. I need you to get on a wyvern and destroy the whole damned thing! Here are your bombs - now
column6: talk to Wing Commander Brack when you're ready for takeoff.

column1: Mission: The Abyssal Shelf^62^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Wing Commander Gryphongar^Wing Commander Gryphongar^^Wing Commander Gryphongar^Return to the Abyssal Shelf
column2: Go to the Front^Wing Commander Gryphongar at Shatter Point in Hellfire Peninsula has asked that you destroy 20 Gan'arg Peons
column3: 5 Mo'arg Overseers and 5 Fel Cannons.^Now that you've got your wings
column4: perhaps you'd be interested in running another bombing mission? This time we've isolated the Legion's main production area
column5: behind the forge camps to the north. I need you to get on a gryphon and destroy the whole damned thing! Here are your bombs - now
column6: talk to Gryphoneer Windbellow when you're ready for takeoff.

column1: Everything Will Be Alright^67^All^Auchenai Crypts^Greatfather Aldrimus^Greatfather Aldrimus^^^^Greatfather Aldrimus standing outside the Auchenai Crypts of Auchindoun has asked that you enter the Auchenai Crypts and destroy Exarch Maladaar.^You've had quite an adventure
column2: <name>. And before you've even set foot inside of the Auchenai Crypts. I am one of the fortunate spirits. I was neither bound to Levixus nor a part of Exarch Maladaar's vile experiments in necromancy. While you have destroyed Levixus
column3: Maladaar lives on
column4: continuing to torment the spirits inside the crypts. What I ask is simple. Enter the Auchenai Crypts and destroy Exarch Maladaar so that the spirits trapped inside can finally rest in peace.

column1: Undercutting the Competition^66^All^Mana-Tombs^Nexus-Prince Haramad^Nexus-Prince Haramad^^^^Nexus-Prince Haramad located outside of the Mana-Tombs wants you to kill Nexus-Prince Shaffar and bring Shaffar's Wrappings back to him.^That Shaffar is a shrewd one - I'll give him that... He's managed to keep the Consortium out while he safely pillages this crypt for all it's worth. I have no faith in these imbeciles actually breaking through Shaffar's defenses so I'll make you a deal
column2: <race>. Enter the Mana-Tombs and kill Nexus-Prince Shaffar. Bring me back his body wrap as proof of this deed and I'll reward you handsomely.

column1: Whitebark's Memory^10^Horde^Eversong Woods^Larianna Riverwind^Whitebark's Spirit^Old Whitebark's Pendant^^^Larianna Riverwind wants you to place Old Whitebark's Pendant by the runestone at the Scorched Grove.^This pendant brings back memories of a different time. A better time. Unfortunately
column2: memories are the last thing I need right now. I want you to bury this by the runestone in the Scorched Grove. It was there that I first met the treant elder. Put my old friend's memory to rest.

column1: Auchindoun...^68^Horde^Auchenai Crypts^A'dal^D'ore^A Visit With the Greatmother^^^Travel to the Auchenai Crypts in the Bone Wastes of Terokkar Forest and slay Exarch Maladaar to free the spirit of D'ore.^Deep within the Auchenai Crypts is a tomb: A tomb unlike any that exists on this shattered realm. It was from this tomb
column2: the first tomb
column3: that the vast mausoleum of Auchindoun was born. You must venture to the Auchenai Crypts of Auchindoun and find this tomb. Slay the guardian of the crypt to release the captive spirit within. The spirit holds the key...

column1: What the Soul Sees^68^Horde^Nagrand^D'ore^Mother Kashur^A Visit With the Greatmother^^^Locate a Soul Mirror somewhere in the Auchenai Crypts and use it to call forth a Darkened Spirit from Ancient Orc Ancestors in Nagrand. Destroy 15 Darkened Spirits so that the ancestors may rest in peace.^For several centuries
column2: the spirits of Auchindoun coalesced into my darkened essence. Many of the catastrophes that befell this crypt were a direct result of my weakened state. Regrettably
column3: there is nothing that can be done to stop this cycle. It is a facet of the naaru condition - without the void
column4: the Light cannot exist. Your only recourse is to destroy the ancient spirits of Nagrand before they transform into creatures of the void. Use the soul mirrors found throughout this crypt to free them...

column1: Return to the Greatmother^68^Horde^Nagrand^Mother Kashur^Greatmother Geyah^A Visit With the Greatmother^^^Return to Garadar and speak to Greatmother Geyah.^Return to Greatmother Geyah at Garadar with news of your victory
column2: <name>. This will surely lift the spirits of the Mag'har. Perhaps even the young Hellscream will be lifted from his malaise.

column1: The Inconsolable Chieftain^68^Horde^Nagrand^Greatmother Geyah^Garrosh^A Visit With the Greatmother^^^Greatmother Geyah at Garadar has asked that you speak with Garrosh.^You have done so much for the Mag'har
column2: <name>. Your accomplishments are known to all
column3: including Garrosh. Go to him now and tell him of your latest victory. Tell him that you do what you do for him and his people. Surely he will be lifted by your words.

column1: There Is No Hope^68^Horde^Nagrand^Garrosh^Greatmother Geyah^A Visit With the Greatmother^^^Speak to Greatmother Geyah and tell her what Garrosh told you.^You are an honorable <race>
column2: <name>. You have done much for the Mag'har. No one could ever deny your service to my people. Alas
column3: the time of the Mag'har is at an end. You have shown me
column4: more than anything
column5: that I am unfit to lead these people. My cursed blood runs too deep. I will not... I cannot become the second Hellscream to damn the orcs. Please
column6: <name>
column7: return to the Greatmother and tell her what I have told you. I am too ashamed to see her... to look into her eyes.

column1: The Archmage's Staff^68^All^Netherstorm^Ravandwyr^Ravandwyr^The Archmage's Staff^^^Retrieve Archmage Vargoth's Staff from Ekkorash the Inquisitor and bring it to Ravandwyr in Area 52. To bring Ekkorash out of hiding
column2: sprinkle the Conjuring Powder on the brazier in the center of the ruins.^Allow me to introduce myself
column3: <class>. I am Ravandwyr
column4: apprentice to the Archmage Vargoth. My master is... indisposed
column5: shall we say. I am here on a matter of great importance. The Arklon Ruins southeast of the city are a hotbed of Burning Legion activity. Their purpose in the ruins concerns neither me nor my master
column6: but their leader
column7: Ekkorash
column8: possesses the archmage's staff. This conjuring powder will allow you to draw the demon out of hiding. Sprinkle it on the brazier at the center of the ruins.

column1: Curse of the Violet Tower^68^All^Netherstorm^Ravandwyr^Image of Archmage Vargoth^The Archmage's Staff^^Malevolent Remnants
column2: A Fate Worse Than Death
column3: The Unending Invasion^Use Archmage Vargoth's Staff to make contact with Archmage Vargoth.^Now
column4: you will be able to use the archmage's staff to contact him. He resides in the Violet Tower
column5: on an 'island' to the southeast. The tower is both sanctuary and prison to him
column6: cursed as it is. Kirin Tor can neither enter nor leave
column7: keeping me apart from my master. The staff's magic can penetrate the tower's defenses
column8: but only if invoked by one outside the Kirin Tor. Take the archmage's staff and use it to conjure his image. Tell him what has happened and that I have not completely failed him.

column1: Thrall
column2: Son of Durotan^68^Horde^Nagrand^Greatmother Geyah^Thrall^A Visit With the Greatmother^^^Venture to Orgrimmar and deliver Geyah's message to Thrall.^Return to your world
column3: <name>. Go to my grandchild and tell him that his blood is here - on this shattered world. Tell him that his father's legacy lives on. Tell him everything...

column1: Ar'kelos the Guardian^68^All^Netherstorm^Image of Archmage Vargoth^Archmage Vargoth^The Archmage's Staff^^Finding the Keymaster^Enter the Violet Tower at the center of Kirin'Var Village and defeat Ar'kelos
column2: then speak with Archmage Vargoth.^Now that you've gathered all the items I'll need to break Kael'thas's curse
column3: one thing remains to be done. When Kael'thas sealed the tower
column4: he placed an arcane golem
column5: known as Ar'kelos
column6: at the bottom of the tower. You must defeat Ar'kelos in order allow me to work magic within the tower again. When you enter the Violet Tower
column7: the curse will begin to affect you. Once you have defeated Ar'kelos
column8: ascend the tower and assist me in making preparations for the ritual.

column1: Trouble at Auchindoun^70^All^Terokkar Forest^Spymistress Mehlisah Highcrown^Field Commander Mahfuun^Trouble at Auchindoun^^^Report to Field Commander Mahfuun at the entrance to the Shadow Labyrinth at Auchindoun in Terokkar Forest.^I have spies within Auchindoun and they have been sending me disturbing reports. That place has been nothing but trouble ever since it exploded a couple of years ago. Something in there has gone horribly wrong - again - and the Shadow Council is now on a war footing. Though the reports were lacking on details
column2: their preparations appear to be directed inward. You must make your way to the entrance of the Shadow Labyrinth. My field commander
column3: Mahfuun
column4: will fill you in on what needs to be done.

column1: Find Spy To'gun^70^All^Lower City^Spy Grik'tha^Spy To'gun^Find Spy To'gun^^^Locate Spy To'gun in the Shadow Labyrinth of Auchindoun.^To'gun
column2: the fool! We're barely holding off the attacks here
column3: and he goes back in to get more information and try to save the other spies! I don't know whether to love him or kill him! The Shadow Council must have used magic to ferret us out
column4: because all of our spies had to get out of there in a hurry. Most of us didn't make it. Please
column5: if you're brave enough to enter the Shadow Labyrinth
column6: will you keep an eye peeled for To'gun? It's been a while
column7: and I fear the worst.

column1: Can't Stay Away^69^All^Terokkar Forest^Oloraak^Isfar^^^^Speak with Isfar
column2: who can be found near the entrance to the Sethekk Halls in Auchindoun.^I tried to persuade Isfar to remain here
column3: in the safety of Shattrath
column4: but he would have none of it. Instead
column5: he's decided to venture out to Auchindoun again on his own. He was lucky enough to escape the Sethekk Halls once
column6: but if they discover him
column7: there won't be a second time. I admire his desire to free his sister
column8: but he's not going to be able to do it without help. Find Isfar and have a word with him
column9: <name>. If you can't persuade him to come back
column10: perhaps you could help him rescue Lakka?

column1: Battle-Mage Dathric^68^All^Netherstorm^Dathric's Blade^Custodian Dieworth^^^^Locate Battle-Mage Dathric's quarters in Wizard's Row and return the blade to his weapon rack. Then
column2: speak with Custodian Dieworth at Kirin'Var Village.^The sword is of exceptional quality
column3: finely crafted and perfectly balanced for a battle-mage. The seal of the Kirin Tor and the name "Dathric" are engraved into the weapon's pommel. Turning the weapon over in your hands
column4: you notice a sense of wrongness radiating from the metal
column5: as if the item is torn between two worlds. Could this be the item anchoring Battle-Mage Dathric's spirit to this world? Perhaps returning it to its proper place can break the bond
column6: freeing Dathric's spirit to rest at last.

column1: Off To Area 52^68^All^Netherstorm^Netherologist Coppernickels^Rocket-Chief Fuselage^Netherologist Coppernickels^^^Deliver the Netherologist's Notes to Rocket-Chief Fuselage at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^I'm out here studying the nether - the ethereal currents and all that. This is an ideal spot away from the lights and hubbub of town. Isn't this bridge great? If I could just keep this junk working. Hey
column2: you know
column3: if you're looking for work there's plenty at Area 52! It's just up the path and take a right at the fork in the road. Why don't you deliver my latest research notes to Rocket-Chief Fuselage? I'm sure that he'd have plenty for you to do
column4: what with the X-52 rocket ship
column5: and all!

column1: Malevolent Remnants^68^All^Netherstorm^Custodian Dieworth^Custodian Dieworth^Malevolent Remnants^Curse of the Violet Tower^^Custodian Dieworth at Kirin'Var Village wants you to defeat 20 Severed Spirits in Kirin'Var's Town Square.^Most of the spirits in the village are little more than pale remnants of Kirin Tor mages. They retain no knowledge of their former selves and wander the ruins in blind anger. It wasn't always like this
column2: though. In the immediate aftermath of the attack
column3: the spirits were restless
column4: but not spiteful. With the passage of time they have only grown more aggressive. I dare not venture into the southern part of the village
column5: for they will not spare even me. Quiet them and let us hope it will purge their anger.

column1: A Fate Worse Than Death^68^All^Netherstorm^Custodian Dieworth^Custodian Dieworth^^Curse of the Violet Tower^^Kill 10 Mageslayers and 10 Mana Seekers and return to Custodian Dieworth at Kirin'Var Village.^After the blood elves leveled Kirin'Var Village
column2: they started the construction of a large building to the northwest. Without the expertise of the archmage
column3: we can't say for certain what's going on there. One thing is clear
column4: though. The blood elf activities have unleashed a tide of ravenous mana elementals on the village. They seem drawn to the ruins of Wizard Row
column5: wreaking further destruction. We cannot permit this to continue.

column1: You're Hired!^68^All^Netherstorm^Rocket-Chief Fuselage^Rocket-Chief Fuselage^Netherologist Coppernickels^^Invaluable Asset Zapping
column2: Report to Engineering^Collect 10 Etherlithium Matrix Crystals and return them to Rocket-Chief Fuselage at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^Let me be the first to welcome you aboard
column3: Junior Technician 3rd Grade <name>! We're building my masterpiece out here - the X-52 Nether-Rocket! But first we need to get all of the parts and fuel for it. That's where you come in. To start
column4: I need crystals - LOTS of crystals - for the rocket's Etherlithium Engine Matrix. The draenei had crystals coming out of their ears! So head north to the Ruins of Enkaat and get them for me! Nevermind all of the draenei ghosts.

column1: The Sigil of Krasus^69^All^Netherstorm^Image of Archmage Vargoth^Image of Archmage Vargoth^The Archmage's Staff^^^Retrieve the Sigil of Krasus from Spellbinder Maryana at Manaforge Coruu
column2: northwest of the Violet Tower.^Before we departed Azeroth all those years ago
column3: the Kirin Tor entrusted our expedition with a powerful artifact
column4: the Sigil of Krasus. It was a great boon to us in our battle against the orcs and it could play a key role in helping me break the enchantment that imprisons me. However
column5: when Kael'thas divested me of my possessions
column6: he gave the sigil to Spellbinder Maryana
column7: who remained behind with the garrison. If he truly realized what he had in his possession
column8: he wouldn't have given it away so easily.

column1: Manaforge B'naar^68^All^Netherstorm^Spymaster Thalodien^Spymaster Thalodien^Report to Spymaster Thalodien^^Bloodgem Crystals^Spymaster Thalodien at Area 52 wants you to go to the outskirts of Manaforge B'naar and retrieve the B'naar Personnel Roster from Captain Arathyn.^You may have noticed one of Kael's manaforges on your way here. You know
column2: the large purple buildings sucking energy from the sky? We were sent here by the Sha'tar to investigate them. You can help our information gathering efforts by obtaining a personnel roster. Giving us an idea of who's there and what they do will prove to be invaluable information. We believe Captain Arathyn
column3: leading a ballista team just outside of Manaforge B'naar
column4: is in possession of one such roster. Obtain it for us.

column1: Recharging the Batteries^68^All^Netherstorm^Bot-Specialist Alley^Bot-Specialist Alley^^^^Use the Battery Recharging Blaster on enough Phase Hunters to get the Battery Recharge Level to 10. Then return it to Bot-Specialist Alley at the Ruins of Enkaat in the Netherstorm.^I have the very important task of collecting the machinery inside these ruins
column2: but I'm having a problem keeping all of my bots charged up. The phase hunters - those wyrm-looking things - have lots of energy! You can find them all over the edges of this island
column3: floating in from the nether. Fill the battery on this recharging blaster by using it on a phase hunter when they're very weak
column4: and then finish it off to soak up the last of its energy.

column1: Mark V is Alive!^68^All^Netherstorm^Maxx A. Million Mk. V^Bot-Specialist Alley^^^^Escort the Maxx A. Million Mk. V through the Ruins of Enkaat and back out to safety. Then speak with Bot-Specialist Alley just outside the Ruins of Enkaat in the Netherstorm.^Greetings
column2: <race>. I am charged up and fully functional. There are fragile draenei machines in these ruins
column3: which I must retrieve. I am equipped with delicate servos in my wrist actuators
column4: and the latest in combustion-pneumatic bump soakers. Handling them with care will not be an issue. However
column5: the ghosts that haunt these ruins will likely attack
column6: so I will need you and your friends along for protection.

column1: Krasus's Compendium^69^All^Netherstorm^Image of Archmage Vargoth^Image of Archmage Vargoth^The Archmage's Staff^^Torching Sunfury Hold^Reclaim Krasus's Compendium - Chapter 1
column2: Krasus's Compendium - Chapter 2
column3: and Krasus's Compendium - Chapter 3 from Kirin'Var Village's Town Square.^The Kirin Tor sent one other of Krasus's possessions with our expedition. It was his spellbook
column4: called Krasus's Compendium. Containing all the spells he mastered
column5: it lent us a much-needed advantage in the war. Before Kael'thas and his forces laid siege to Kirin'Var
column6: the compendium had been stolen from me by a rebellious apprentice intent on studying necromancy. The apprentice and his followers divided and studied the text in secret
column7: locking themselves inside their houses in the southern part of town.

column1: High Value Targets^68^All^Netherstorm^Spymaster Thalodien^Spymaster Thalodien^Report to Spymaster Thalodien^^^Spymaster Thalodien at Area 52 wants you to go to Manaforge B'naar and slay 2 Sunfury Warp-Masters
column2: 6 Sunfury Warp-Engineers and 8 Sunfury Geologists.^Based on the roster information
column3: we know that the brains of the manaforge operations are the warp-masters and warp-engineers. It is they who oversee the retrieval of a so called "warp-energy" by the manaforge and its delivery to a remote destination via a system of underground pipes. The only other specialists in the area are geologists. Everyone else is either part of the military or a magister crony; both easily replaced. Get in there and kill Kael's specialists; that's what'll hurt him the most.

column1: Stealth Flight^68^All^Netherstorm^Spymaster Thalodien^Veronia^Report to Spymaster Thalodien^^^Speak to Veronia outside Area 52 and fly to Manaforge Coruu.^While you were gone
column2: my men uncovered another one of these manaforges. It is east of here and is known as Manaforge Coruu. Two of my best spies have arranged a secret landing spot outside of the manaforge. You are to help them infiltrate Kael's forces and obtain whatever information you can. Speak to Veronia just outside the city walls; she's arranged for a windrider that will take you to Manaforge Coruu. Once there
column3: speak to Caledis Brightdawn; he will brief you on your mission.

column1: A Convincing Disguise^68^All^Netherstorm^Caledis Brightdawn^Caledis Brightdawn^Report to Spymaster Thalodien^^^Obtain a set of Sunfury Arcanist Robes
column2: one pair of Sunfury Researcher Gloves and a Sunfury Guardsman Medallion and bring them to Caledis Brightdawn at Manaforge Coruu in Netherstorm.^Infiltrating the ranks of Kael's army will not be an easy task. With my knowledge of illusionary magic I could pass you off as one of Kael's followers
column3: but there are certain details in their uniforms I could not replicate. Bring me a set of their robes
column4: a pair of their gloves and a Sunfury guardsman medallion. This will make the results of my magic much more convincing.

column1: Information Gathering^68^All^Netherstorm^Caledis Brightdawn^Caledis Brightdawn^Report to Spymaster Thalodien^^^Use the Sunfury Disguise
column2: go into Manaforge Coruu and listen to the conversation between Commander Dawnforge and Arcanist Ardonis. Report back to Caledis Brightdawn at Manaforge Coruu after completing this task.^I've prepared a uniform with the pieces you obtained. It is magically enhanced to complete the illusion. We spotted Commander Dawnforge going in to meet Arcanist Ardonis a few minutes ago. He had a full retinue of guards with him
column3: so whatever they're discussing is bound to be incredibly important; see if you can catch any of it. Oh
column4: I almost forgot. You'll want to stay away from the arcane golems patrolling the manaforge. They will see right through the illusion.

column1: That Little Extra Kick^68^All^Netherstorm^Boots^Boots^Securing the Shaleskin Shale^^^Obtain 5 Nether Ray Stingers for Boots at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^So
column2: I'm just missing the one ingredient that'll give my concoction that little extra kick that it needs. The sting of the nether rays
column3: roaming around near the shaleskin flayers
column4: delivers quite a punch. Bring me some of their stingers and I'll extract the venom right out of them! I'm certain the results will be explosive!

column1: Return to Thalodien^68^All^Netherstorm^Caledis Brightdawn^Spymaster Thalodien^Report to Spymaster Thalodien^^^Return to Spymaster Thalodien at Area 52 in Netherstorm.^It would be best if this information got back to Thalodien as soon as possible. I'll stay here and cover our tracks. It wouldn't do us much good to have Kael'thas find out what we were snooping around here. Secret information is always better if your enemy doesn't know you have it.
And Now
column2: the Moment of Truth^65^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Rakoria^Rakoria^Olemba Seed Oil^^^Find Grek and ask him to try it on his weapon. Once he's tried out the oil
column3: return to Rakoria with the results.^The oil is finally ready for its first test. It seems heavy enough to serve as a high quality weapon oil. The only way to find out is to have a professional try it out. See Grek over there by the wanted posters? Sure
column4: he's no poet
column5: but the orc knows his way around a weapon! Take a sample of the oil to him and ask him to use it on his weapon. After he's had a chance to test it out
column6: let me know what he thinks of it.

column1: A Defector^70^All^Netherstorm^Magistrix Larynna^Magister Theledorn^Kick Them While They're Down^^^Go to Manaforge Ara and speak to Magister Theledorn.^We've recently been contacted by a Sunfury magister who wishes to join our ranks and swears he has information we're in need of. We've checked our informants to make sure he's not a double agent and he checks out. He's stationed in Manaforge Ara which makes communication difficult. Talk to him and see what he knows. If he's half as useful as he claims to be
column2: we'll be able to put him to good use.

column1: Invaluable Asset Zapping^69^All^Netherstorm^Rocket-Chief Fuselage^Lead Sapper Blastfizzle^^You're Hired!^Dr. Boom!^Use the Ultra Deconsolodation Zapper to beam the Hyper Rotational Dig-A-Matic
column2: Servo-Pneumatic Dredging Claw
column3: Multi-Spectrum Terrain Analyzer
column4: and the Big Wagon Full of Explosives back to Area 52. Then report to Lead Sapper Blastfizzle at the eastern end of the fissure that runs through Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^See the fissure running through Area 52? We did that! It's yielding up all sorts of goodies for the X-52 Nether-Rocket
column5: but we're running short on equipment. We had an operation at the Arklon Ruins to the southeast until the Burning Legion moved in. I need you to take this Ultra Deconsolodation Zapper to the ruins. Use it to beam our gear back to Lead Sapper Blastfizzle down in the fissure. Junior Technician 3rd Grade <name>
column6: this is your chance for that promotion. Don't blow it!

column1: Bloodgem Crystals^68^All^Netherstorm^Magistrix Larynna^Magistrix Larynna^^Manaforge B'naar^^Magistrix Larynna wants you to go to Manaforge B'naar and obtain a Bloodgem Shard from a Sunfury Magister. Use this shard near the larger Bloodgem crystals and return to her at Area 52.^Kael's magisters have refined their usage of mana crystals to the point where they can siphon large amounts of energy in a matter of seconds. They do this by attuning smaller bloodgem crystal shards to larger
column2: fully charged ones. Go to Manaforge B'naar and obtain one of these shards from a Sunfury magister and use it to siphon energy from one of the larger crystals. Return to me so that I may study the effects of the aura. Do not worry; any side effects should be temporary.

column1: Warp-Raider Nesaad^69^All^Netherstorm^Nether-Stalker Khay'ji^Nether-Stalker Khay'ji^Warp-Raider Nesaad^A Heap of Ethereals^^Kill Warp-Raider Nesaad and then return to Nether-Stalker Khay'ji at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^Warp-Raider Nesaad must be dealt with! I have no idea how he survived my attack
column2: but he cannot be allowed to continue his operation out there. Go back and take out Nesaad. He keeps a small ethereal camp near the southwestern corner of the Heap. Don't fail like I did
column3: <class>.

column1: Pick Your Part^68^All^Netherstorm^Papa Wheeler^Papa Wheeler^^Consortium Crystal Collection^In A Scrap With The Legion
column2: Help Mama Wheeler^Collect 10 pieces of Ethereal Technology and return them to Papa Wheeler at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^Those ethereal clowns are as opportunistic as us
column3: I'll give them that. But no one
column4: and I mean NO ONE
column5: moves in on a B.O.O.M. claim! The Heap to the south is ours! If we're to finish the X-52 Nether-Rocket
column6: we're going to need all of the new tech that we can get our hands on. And since the ethereals are stealing from us
column7: I think it's only fair that we repay them in kind. Why don't you head down there and see if you can acquire some of their technology out from under their noses!

column1: Disrupt Their Reinforcements^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Forward Commander To'arch^Forward Commander To'arch^Through the Dark Portal^^^Defeat enemies around Portal Xilus and Portal Kruul to gather Demonic Rune Stones.^Directly east of here is the Legion Front. Spaced across the front are infernal portals and gateways
column2: used to bring reinforcements to Hellfire Peninsula and throughout Outland. We're going to destroy those portals! Take these primers. Designed in Area 52
column3: they use the demons' own power as an explosive! Defeat Legion forces around Portals Xilus and Kruul to gather demonic rune stones
column4: use the primer to detonate four stones inside the portals
column5: and watch! Return to me when your mission is complete.

column1: Summoner Kanthin's Prize^69^All^Netherstorm^Image of Archmage Vargoth^Image of Archmage Vargoth^The Archmage's Staff^^^Defeat Summoner Kanthin at Manaforge Duro
column2: on the island to the north of Sunfury Hold
column3: and reclaim the Stone of Glacius from him.^The next thing we must do is reclaim my familiar
column4: Glacius
column5: from the blood elf summoner who holds it captive. Summoner Kanthin was one of the most senior magisters in the force Kael'thas sent to decimate Kirin'Var. It's only natural that he would claim my familiar as a kind of trophy. I'm certain that Kanthin
column6: fool that he is
column7: has tried to compel Glacius to serve him. My scrying has revealed that Kanthin is now stationed at 'Manaforge Duro
column8: ' if that terminology has any meaning for you.

column1: A'dal^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Haggard War Veteran^A'dal^^^City of Light^Speak to A'dal
column2: the leader of the Sha'tar
column3: in the center of the Terrace of Light.^Welcome to Shattrath City
column4: <class>. This might be the one place in all of Outland where you'll find any semblance of safety. A group of naaru known as the Sha'tar drove the demons away from here. If you've never met a naaru
column5: you ought to see A'dal inside the Terrace of Light. The leader of the Sha'tar is an awe-inspiring sight if I ever saw one. Sure is a change of pace from anything else in this bleak land.

column1: City of Light^65^All^Shattrath City^Khadgar^Khadgar^^A'dal^Allegiance to the Aldor
column2: Allegiance to the Scryers^Follow Khadgar's servant and listen to its story. Return to Khadgar after completing this task.^Do not burden A'dal with petty inquisitions
column3: <class>. That just might be the most powerful being you ever come face to face with. You do not look familiar. I suppose you want to learn about the city? You'll have to excuse me if I don't give you a tour myself
column4: but I'm a bit busy discussing strategy with A'dal. Perhaps you'll find a summoned servant acceptable in my stead? Excellent!

column1: Hero of the Mag'har^68^Horde^Nagrand^Thrall^Greatmother Geyah^A Visit With the Greatmother^^^Return to Greatmother Geyah at Garadar in Nagrand.^I must set things in order before I leave. Return to the Greatmother and tell her that her grandson comes.

Investigate the Crash^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Grelag^"Screaming" Screed Luckheed^A Hasty Departure^^^Search for crash survivors.^When I was wounded in the wastes I saw a goblin zeppelin crash. It went down to the northwest
column2: beyond the Expedition Armory. The zeppelin was on fire. Shrieking
column3: burning goblins were falling like bombs from the sky. Of course I was in a lot of pain and I had lost a lot of blood. I may have imagined the whole thing. If you can find any survivors
column4: we can offer them sanctuary here at Spinebreaker Post.

column1: Safety Is Job One^66^All^Mana-Tombs^Artificer Morphalius^Ethereal Transporter Control Panel^^^Someone Else's Hard Work Pays Off^Artificer Morphalius wants you to kill 10 Ethereal Crypt Raiders
column2: 5 Ethereal Sorcerers
column3: 5 Nexus Stalkers and 5 Ethereal Spellbinders.^Shaffar's ethereals have completely blocked us out of the Mana-Tombs. Thankfully
column4: I've got a plan. While we can't go in through the front door
column5: there are sure to be several transporters inside. I want you to clear the way for my crew first and then I want you to activate one of their transporters to teleport us inside. Activate the teleporter in the chamber right before Shaffar's chambers when the way has been cleared. Don't worry
column6: I'll make it worth your while...

column1: Someone Else's Hard Work Pays Off^66^All^Mana-Tombs^Cryo-Engineer Sha'heen^Nexus-Prince Haramad^^Safety Is Job One^^Escort Cryo-Engineer Sha'heen safely through the Mana-Tombs so that he can gather the ether held inside Shaffar's ether collectors.^Who were you expecting!? That idiot Morphalius was 'de-prioritized.' Now I'm here to clean up his mess. All I need from you is to watch my back as I go through Shaffar's ether gatherers and suck them dry of all that they have collected. If I successfully complete my mission
column2: Haramad himself will reward you! What do you say? Escort me through the Mana-Tombs and then collect some incredible treasure? You already did most of the work anyway! Nothing's alive back behind us
column3: right?

column1: Make Them Listen^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Emissary Mordiba^Emissary Mordiba^^^^Mordiba wants you to defeat 12 Unyielding Footmen
column2: 8 Unyielding Knights
column3: and 6 Unyielding Sorcerers at the Expedition Armory to the west of Spinebreaker Post.^I was sent here to make contact with the Unyielding spirits. These once proud Alliance soldiers were defeated long ago
column4: and now their cursed spirits haunt the ruins to the west. If they would only join us we would gain a powerful ally. Imagine
column5: a legion of undying warriors to use against our enemies. But these undead are mad with hatred and will not listen to me. Perhaps they can be forced to join us.

column1: Dr. Boom!^68^All^Netherstorm^Lead Sapper Blastfizzle^Lead Sapper Blastfizzle^^Invaluable Asset Zapping^^Kill Dr. Boom and return with the good news to Lead Sapper Blastfizzle at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^<name>
column2: my former protege
column3: Sparky Uberthruster
column4: wouldn't wear his helmet while down here and one day transformed into the infamous Dr. Boom! And he stole off to the northeast with most of our sapping equipment! He and his Boom Bots have been a menace to Area 52 ever since. I need you to go to his Camp of Boom just outside of town and put an end to him! Use these Boom's Doom bombs to take him out. And make sure not to get too close to him or his Boom Bots!

column1: The Sunfury Garrison^69^All^Netherstorm^Custodian Dieworth^Custodian Dieworth^The Sunfury Garrison^^^Custodian Dieworth at Kirin'Var Village wants you to kill 10 Sunfury Archers.^After Prince Kael'thas's forces destroyed the village and imprisoned the archmage in the Violet Tower
column2: they withdrew to Sunfury Hold to the northeast. The very men who destroyed our village and slew our fellows toast their 'amazing victory' while we are helpless to avenge the fallen. We must not allow these crimes to go unanswered! Be the instrument of our vengeance
column3: <name>. Go to Sunfury Hold and claim the lives of those responsible for this crime.

column1: Down With Daellis^69^All^Netherstorm^Custodian Dieworth^Custodian Dieworth^The Sunfury Garrison^^^Custodian Dieworth at Kirin'Var Village wants you to kill Master Daellis Dawnstrike.^I'll never forget the blood elf who led the attack. He wore a tabard with a device I've never seen before
column2: over top of crimson armor. He was ferocious and merciless
column3: leading from the front where most other blood elf officers would never be seen. He was responsible for the deaths of many Kirin Tor mages that day
column4: but he didn't linger long at Sunfury Hold. Kael'thas has ordered him to Manaforge Duro to aid in their attempt to control the area. Find him
column5: <name>
column6: and silence his bow for good.

column1: Essence for the Engines^68^All^Netherstorm^Chief Engineer Trep^Chief Engineer Trep^Report to Engineering^^^Collect 7 Mana Wraith Essences and return them to Chief Engineer Trep at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^As the X-52's chief of engineering
column2: I have to see to it that the nether-rocket's main engines are in tip-top shape. Unfortunately
column3: I haven't built them yet. <class>
column4: I'm in dire straits here! I have almost all of the parts. All that I'm missing is the engine core. Luckily for us
column5: I think we can make use of the essence from the local mana wraiths to jump-start the engines. They can be found near most of the glowing trenches in the northern part of the island. Except for here in Area 52
column6: of course.

column1: Report to Engineering^68^All^Netherstorm^Rocket-Chief Fuselage^Chief Engineer Trep^Report to Engineering^You're Hired!^^Deliver the Etherlithium Matrix Crystals to Chief Engineer Trep at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^<name>! I need you to take all of these etherlithium crystals over to Chief Engineer Trep
column2: my
column3: uh
column4: chief of engineering. He should know what to do with them. And if he doesn't
column5: you see to it that he finds out!

column1: Elemental Power Extraction^68^All^Netherstorm^Chief Engineer Trep^Chief Engineer Trep^Report to Engineering^^^Extract 5 Elemental Power for Chief Engineer Trep at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^Darn it
column2: that didn't do it! Ok
column3: I've got another idea! I had Xyrol whip up an elemental power extractor. I'm not certain exactly what this power will do
column4: but I know that I can use it. The sundered rumblers and warp aberrations on the ledge of the Crumbling Wastes to the south have just what I need for the engines! The extractor will change the form of their power into something solid that you'll be able to gather up after you've defeated them.

column1: I See Dead Draenei^67^All^Terokkar Forest^Ha'lei^Ramdor the Mad^I See Dead Draenei^^^Speak to Ramdor the Mad
column2: standing on the bone pile outside of the Auchenai Crypts.^I see dead draenei. They're all around us. Bah
column3: nobody believes me because I'm a child. Not even my own mommy believes me. <Ha'lei points to Ramdor.> He believes me
column4: though... He sees them too. Boy does he get angry about it! It's kind of funny. I see ghosts and people just smile and pat me on the head
column5: trying to placate me. Ramdor sees ghosts and people label him as crazy. I sure hope I never grow up! You should probably talk to Ramdor before you go inside. He was once a death priest.

column1: Ezekiel^67^All^Shattrath City^Ramdor the Mad^Ezekiel^I See Dead Draenei^^^Find and speak with Ezekiel of Shattrath in Shattrath City.^I believe that the dead
column2: which we have been caring for these last 500 odd years
column3: should be left alone. Maladaar has other plans. He has retreated to the Crypt of Remembrance to start his experiments... Necromancy. I hope you weren't thinking about going in there... Not before helping me out so that these damned spirits will finally leave me alone. I know where they keep their treasures
column4: <race>. Got your attention
column5: eh? Bring me the book of the dead
column6: held by the Aldor
column7: Ezekiel of Shattrath.

column1: Decipher the Tome^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^A Mysterious Tome^Althen the Historian^Decipher the Tome^^^Take the Mysterious Tome to Althen the Historian in Spinebreaker Post.^This tome appears to be some sort of history written in a secret Alliance cipher. Althen
column2: the historian in Spinebreaker Post
column3: has studied the Unyielding for some time; he may be able to crack the Alliance code and decipher the book.

column1: The Battle Horn^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Althen the Historian^Althen the Historian^Decipher the Tome^^^Take the Unyielding Battle Horn from Lieutenant Commander Thalvos and bring it to Althen the Historian in Spinebreaker Post.^Perhaps we have taken the wrong approach to the Unyielding? The tome tells me the Expedition Armory was destroyed by orcs and death knights long ago. The Unyielding remain here as vengeful spirits trapped in an eternal battle against the fel orc clans. They think only of revenge. We must arrange for them to defeat their most hated enemies. Enter the Expedition Armory once again and find Lieutenant Commander Thalvos. He carries a battle horn that can summon the Unyielding. Bring it to me.

What Book? I Don't See Any Book.^67^All^Shattrath City^Ezekiel^"Dirty" Larry^I See Dead Draenei^^^Ezekiel said the book has been stolen. Your best bet is to find the Ruffians and see if they have any information.^Ramdor? Hrm
column2: let me think... Ramdor... Oh yes
column3: the death priest. What does he want with the book? Well it doesn't matter. Yes I lied to you and no I don't have the book. Not anymore
column4: anyway. It was stolen. Probably by one of those filthy refugees. Besides
column5: Auchindoun is now defunct. We have no use for the book. If you find it
column6: you can keep it. Like I said
column7: I saw some of those ruffians snooping around the terrace last week. Start your search with them. They're probably playing dice in the slums.

column1: In A Scrap With The Legion^69^All^Netherstorm^Papa Wheeler^Papa Wheeler^^Pick Your Part^^Kill 5 Mo'arg Doomsmiths and 15 Gan'arg Engineers. Then return to Papa Wheeler at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^The Burning Legion has moved in on our claim at the Scrap Field down the path and across the bridge to the east. This could be a huge problem for us! With the Legion at the Arklon Ruins
column2: and now there
column3: it's starting to look bad for us - and the rocket project - here at Area 52. <name>
column4: I need you to go out there and deal with those demons! I'd do it
column5: but I'm a lover
column6: not a fighter. Yep
column7: this is going to be trouble
column8: I can feel it!

column1: Torching Sunfury Hold^69^All^Netherstorm^Lieutenant-Sorcerer Morran^Lieutenant-Sorcerer Morran^^Krasus's Compendium^^Using a Flaming Torch
column2: destroy 4 Sunfury Ballistas and 4 Sunfury Tents and return to Lieutenant-Sorcerer Morran at Kirin'Var Village.^Ridding Sunfury Hold of its garrison is not sufficient to keep the blood elves from reoccupying it. Kael'thas's followers are zealous and tenacious. Leaving them anything to use at Sunfury is effectively an invitation to return. No
column3: it must all be destroyed. See to it that their tents and artillery burn to ashes! <The ghost's fists clench.> Steal torches from the Sunfury flamekeepers to accomplish your task
column4: <name>.

column1: One Demon's Trash...^69^All^Netherstorm^Mama Wheeler^Mama Wheeler^Help Mama Wheeler^^^Gather 10 Fel Reaver Parts and return them to Mama Wheeler at the Midrealm Post inside Eco-Dome Midrealm in the Netherstorm.^You look like a capable young <man/woman>! I was wondering if you could lend me a hand? To the east is the Scrap Field
column2: which the Burning Legion has moved into. It's full of huge fel reaver parts. There're also a whole bunch of smaller parts in there that they don't seem to care about. I want you to get in there and get me a lot of those smaller fel reaver parts!

column1: Declawing Doomclaw^69^All^Netherstorm^Mama Wheeler^Mama Wheeler^Help Mama Wheeler^^^Obtain Doomclaw's Hand and deliver it to Mama Wheeler at the Midrealm Post inside Eco-Dome Midrealm in the Netherstorm.^You know what might just discourage them? Take out their leader! It seems to work everywhere else from what I've heard. And when they see a <grizzled /tough> <class>
column2: such as yourself take out their leader... why
column3: I bet they'll tuck tail and run for the hills! Get back in there and take out the big one they call Doomclaw. I hear he keeps himself in the eastern part of the Scrap Field underneath the pipe. Bring me his claw
column4: too! Maybe we can make use of it.

column1: Outland Sucks!^61^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Foreman Razelcraz^Foreman Razelcraz^Outland Sucks!^^^Find 6 Shredder Parts and return to Foreman Razelcraz by the mine northwest of Thrallmar.^I can't believe I left Booty Bay to come to Outland. My cousin Screed Luckheed promised me I would make a fortune
column2: but instead he flew off in his zeppelin and left me here to try to scrape a living out of this mine. How am I suppose to make a living here with helboars and demons and fel orcs attacking all the time? My shredder here was broken yesterday and the parts I need to fix it were stolen by fel orcs. They took the parts into the fissure to the southwest and may have dropped them there.

column1: Warn Area 52!^69^All^Netherstorm^Mama Wheeler^Rocket-Chief Fuselage^Help Mama Wheeler^^^Deliver the bad news to Rocket-Chief Fuselage at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^<name>
column2: you have to get word back to Area 52 immediately! Hurry! Tell the rocket-chief that the Burning Legion is after us now!

column1: How to Serve Goblins^61^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Foreman Razelcraz^Foreman Razelcraz^Outland Sucks!^^^Rescue Manni
column2: Moh and Jakk from the Fel Orc camps and return to Foreman Razelcraz by the mine northwest of Thrallmar.^Why would fel orcs steal my shredder parts? I hate them so much. They just sneak into my camp here and take things all the time. A couple of days ago they stole three of my peons! Now the rest of my peons have run off because they are afraid they are going to be eaten by fel orcs. I can't run a mine without peons. If you could save the peons that I lost maybe the others would come back. The fel orcs have their camps along the wall to the southwest.

column1: Potential Energy Source^69^All^Netherstorm^Lieutenant-Sorcerer Morran^Lieutenant-Sorcerer Morran^The Unending Invasion^^^Lieutenant-Sorcerer Morran at Kirin'Var Village wants you to capture 10 Energy Isolation Cubes from the blood elf operations at Manaforge Coruu.^We are not the only ones battling the influx of the mana beings. The blood elves
column2: too
column3: are troubled by them
column4: but I'm not sure why. Whatever they're involved in over there
column5: they don't seem to be stopping. Instead
column6: I've seen them employ a variety of methods to kill the creatures. The most effective involves magical defenses fueled by some sort of concentrated energy. Capture some of these energy sources and bring them to me. Don't hesitate to stymie the elves if an opportunity presents itself.

column1: Building a Perimeter^69^All^Netherstorm^Lieutenant-Sorcerer Morran^Lieutenant-Sorcerer Morran^The Unending Invasion^^^Use the Rune Activation Device near the East Rune
column2: Northeast Rune
column3: and West Rune. The runes can be found around the perimeter of Kirin'Var Village's Wizard Row and Town Square districts. Return to Lieutenant-Sorcerer Morran once you've completed the task.^We are prepared to try to construct a perimeter around the village using the energy source taken from the blood elves. I can't guarantee that it will work
column4: but we have to attempt it. Otherwise
column5: the mana creatures will surely continue devouring the spirits of the fallen Kirin Tor. Use this device at the small runes around the perimeter of town to release the energy there. If I've woven the field correctly
column6: we should start noticing a difference once you've used the device at each point.

column1: Distraction at Manaforge B'naar^68^All^Netherstorm^Exarch Orelis^Exarch Orelis^Assist Exarch Orelis^^^Slay 8 Sunfury Magisters and 8 Sunfury Bloodwarders and return to Exarch Orelis at Area 52.^We were sent here by the Sha'tar to investigate the manaforges that Kael'thas' army is operating here. Unfortunately
column2: the Scryers threaten to renege on their information-gathering duties unless we support them with military action. We can't afford to compromise this mission over politics
column3: so we've agreed to weaken the manaforge's defenses so that the Scryers can do their work. Prove your loyalty to the Aldor and slay the Sunfury magisters and bloodwarders that guard Manaforge B'naar.

column1: Spinebreaker Post^60^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Apothecary Zelana^Apothecary Albreck^^Apothecary Zelana^Boiling Blood^Apothecary Zelana at Reaver's Fall wants you to speak with Wing Commander Brack to take a wyvern to Spinebreaker Post
column2: and then bring the Bleeding Hollow Blood Sample to Apothecary Albreck at Spinebreaker Post.^<name>
column3: my equipment here is
column4: unfortunately
column5: not configured for all the tests I'd like to perform. However
column6: my colleague at Spinebreaker Post
column7: Apothecary Albreck
column8: possesses the required implements. I have acquired a sample of Bleeding Hollow blood -- gained from a past mission of Thrallmar's agents. Take the sample to Albreck and allow him to study it. To reach Spinebreaker Post
column9: speak with Wing Commander Brack
column10: near the wyverns to the south.

column1: Naaru Technology^68^All^Netherstorm^Anchorite Karja^B'naar Control Console^Naaru Technology^^^Go inside Manaforge B'naar and find the B'naar Control Console.^The Scryers obtained a personnel roster for Manaforge B'naar and are now having a field day picking out assassination targets. They've missed one small bit of information
column2: scribbled on the side of the roster. It appeared to be a password or code like those used to access naaru-made technology like the Exodar or Tempest Keep. Go inside the manaforge and look for a control panel. Copy its readouts on this scroll as well as you can. We must confirm our suspicions about the origin of the technology.

column1: B'naar Console Transcription^68^All^Netherstorm^B'naar Control Console^Anchorite Karja^Naaru Technology^^^Deliver the B'naar Console Transcription to Anchorite Karja at Area 52 in Netherstorm.^You try to transcribe the shapes as you see them flash across your eyes. The results are less than exact
column2: but should serve as adequate evidence to prove or disprove the Aldor's suspicions.

column1: Attack on Manaforge Coruu^68^All^Netherstorm^Exarch Orelis^Exarch Orelis^^Measuring Warp Energies^^Travel to Manaforge Coruu and slay 8 Sunfury Arcanists and 5 Sunfury Researchers. Return to Exarch Orelis when you've completed this task.^Your success at Manaforge B'naar was quite noteworthy. I'm sure that Anchorite Karja will ask you for a repeat performance at Manaforge Coruu next. We've learned of a particularly important regiment of Sunfury arcanists and researchers being deployed there and I would like you to target them. Succeed and you will deliver a crushing blow against our enemy's forces.
Doctor Vomisa
column2: Ph.T.^69^All^Netherstorm^Rocket-Chief Fuselage^Doctor Vomisa
column3: Ph.T.^Help Mama Wheeler^^^Speak with Doctor Vomisa
column4: Ph.T. at the Proving Grounds in Netherstorm.^On the outskirts of town to the east are the Proving Grounds. Our top experimentalist
column5: Doctor Vomisa
column6: has been toying with a combination of fel reaver
column7: ethereal
column8: and of course
column9: goblin technologies there. This is in no small part thanks to your gathering efforts Junior Technician 3rd Grade
column10: <name>! Go to him; I know that he'll have a solution for saving Area 52. And since he's likely to use you as a test subject
column11: if I were you
column12: I'd bring some friends along just in case.

column1: You
column2: Robot^69^All^Netherstorm^Doctor Vomisa
column3: Ph.T.^Doctor Vomisa
column4: Ph.T.^Help Mama Wheeler^^^Activate the Scrap Reaver X6000 Controller and test out its capabilities. Then give your feedback to Doctor Vomisa
column5: Ph.T at the Proving Grounds in the Netherstorm. Deal with any problems that arise.^Doctor Vomisa
column6: Ph.T. at your service. Here
column7: take this controller. I want you to activate it and give my newly-invented Scrap Reaver X6000 a spin. Just stay nearby! The controller is tied to my console here
column8: and if you get too far away
column9: the robot will cease to function. Try out everything... I'll be watching and calibrating its servos based upon your test run.

column1: Back to the Chief!^69^All^Netherstorm^Doctor Vomisa
column2: Ph.T.^Rocket-Chief Fuselage^Help Mama Wheeler^^^Report to Rocket-Chief Fuselage at Area 52 in the Netherstorm immediately!^I'm certain that the rocket-chief is going to want to have a word or two with you! If I were you
column3: I wouldn't hesitate to get back to Area 52 and speak with him!

column1: Bloody Vengeance^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Althen the Historian^Althen the Historian^Decipher the Tome^^^Blow the Unyielding Battle Horn near the Alliance Banner. Kill Urtrak and then return to Althen the Historian at Spinebreaker Post.^East of here is an old destroyed Alliance siege tower. Now scavengers loot it for old nails and bits of scrap. Long ago
column2: many Alliance warriors lost their lives at this tower and their banner was captured by Urtrak
column3: a foul orc commander. Blow the Unyielding battle horn near the Alliance banner. This will get the attention of Urtrak. It may also summon forth warriors who fell in battle long ago.

column1: The Master's Grand Design?^67^All^Nagrand^"Dirty" Larry^Nitrin the Learned^I See Dead Draenei^^^Find Nitrin the Learned at the Abandoned Armory in Nagrand.^A couple of draenei paid us a visit last night. They'd somehow learned that we had the book in our possession and made a very generous offer to "take it off our hands." We didn't ask them what they wanted with the book but the young one kept talking about "the master's grand design
column2: whatever that means. Look, I don't ask questions when money is in play. They gave us a lot of gold and we gave them the book. He said that they lived in Nagrand - in the old Abandoned Armory, north of Telaar.Vision of the Dead^67^All^Nagrand^Nitrin the Learned^Nitrin the Learned^I See Dead Draenei^^^Nitrin at the Abandoned Armory in Nagrand wants you to bring him 1 Mountain Gronn Eyeball, 1 Flawless Greater Windroc Beak, and 1 Aged Clefthoof Blubber.^It has already begun. Levixus stands atop the ruins of Auchindoun and reads from the book of the dead. He calls the dead out by name and, through demonic ritual, binds the tortured souls to his will. He will raise all of Auchindoun if given the chance! But... you must first prepare. You cannot do battle with that which you cannot see. <Nitrin hands you a parchment.> Bring me the items I require to brew the tincture. It will open your mind and allow you to see into the spirit world.Levixus the Soul Caller^67^All^Terokkar Forest^Nitrin the Learned^Ramdor the Mad^I See Dead Draenei^^^Destroy Levixus and take the Book of the Dead from his possession.^Go now, <name>. You will find Levixus on the uppermost ruins of Auchindoun. Enter there from the southern reaches of the Bone Wastes. He stands amidst a storm of souls... Destroy him and take the book of the dead. Once you have the cursed book in your possession, destroy it! Destroy it so that such an atrocity can never again be made possible.Force Commander Danath^60^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Marshal Isildor^Force Commander Danath Trollbane^Through the Dark Portal^^The Legion Reborn, Know your Enemy^Marshal Isildor wants you to report to Force Commander Danath Trollbane in Honor Hold.^<Marshal Isildor spits in the dust.> Well, time to earn your pay. Report at once to Force Commander Trollbane within the keep. He and his advisors will no doubt be heartened to see you. <Marshal Isildor salutes you stoically.> For the Alliance!Testing the Antidote^63^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Thiah Redmane^Thiah Redmane^Helping the Cenarion Post^^^Use the Cenarion Antidote on a Hulking Helboar and observe the results. Once you have the results of the experiment, return to Thiah Redmane at the Cenarion Post in Hellfire Peninsula.^I think there's something we can use in the blood as the base of an antidote. Don't look at me like I've lost my mind! It's a common theme in nature. Often, the cure for something can be derived from the toxin itself. That's just what I aim to do. Ridding the boars of their demonic influence would probably eliminate their aggression and give us insight into how to best attempt to help other species.Testing the Antidote^63^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Thiah Redmane^Thiah Redmane^Helping the Cenarion Post^^^Use the Cenarion Antidote on a Hulking Helboar and observe the results. Once you have the results of the experiment, return to Thiah Redmane at the Cenarion Post in Hellfire Peninsula.^I think there's something we can use in the blood as the base of an antidote. Don't look at me like I've lost my mind! It's a common theme in nature. Often, the cure for something can be derived from the toxin itself. That's just what I aim to do. Ridding the boars of their demonic influence would probably eliminate their aggression and give us insight into how to best attempt to help other species.Capturing the Keystone^70^All^Netherstorm^Archmage Vargoth^Archmage Vargoth^Finding the Keymaster^^^Venture into Tempest Keep's Botanica and retrieve the Keystone from Commander Sarannis. Bring it to Archmage Vargoth at the Violet Tower.^It doesn't surprise me that Kael'thas has put the key to this ward in the hands of someone like Commander Sarannis. Prince Kael'thas is a great many things, but he is no simpleton. In order to break this curse once and for all, you must enter Tempest Keep and claim the keystone. Only once the keystone has been destroyed will I regain my freedom.Honor the Fallen^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Althen the Historian^Commander Hogarth^Decipher the Tome^^^Report to Commander Hogarth in the Expedition Armory.^Hogarth, the commander of the Armory, is in the eastern tower. You must report your victory over Urtrak to him. Perhaps he will be friendly? Of course he may try to consume your soul. One can never tell with spirits such as these. The Unyielding are still against us and will no doubt kill you if they can. Be careful <name>.Wanted: Annihilator Servo!^68^All^Netherstorm^Wanted Poster^Papa Wheeler^^^^Obtain an Annihilator Servo and deliver it to Papa Wheeler at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^WANTED: 1 Annihilator Servo to replace the failing one in my Long Neck Spectrum Analyzer. You and your friends might want to check with the blood elves at Manaforge B'naar to the west to see if they have any spares. They seem to have a few arcane annihilators roaming about. Please deliver the servo in pristine condition to Papa Wheeler at Area 52.A Heap of Ethereals^68^All^Netherstorm^Nether-Stalker Khay'ji^Nether-Stalker Khay'ji^Assisting the Consortium^^Warp-Raider Nesaad, Another Heap of Ethereals^Collect 10 Zaxxis Insignias and return them to Nether-Stalker Khay'ji at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^There is something else that I want your help with. A group of ethereals, known as the Zaxxis, have cut their relationship with the Consortium and gone into business for themselves. They've even cut deals with the Sunfury blood elves. This will not be tolerated! I infiltrated their group at the Heap to the south. But after I took out their leader, I had to escape here to Area 52. <class>, go down there and bring back their insignias. Of course, not all wear them because they're cowards.Assisting the Consortium^68^All^Netherstorm^Anchorite Karja^Nether-Stalker Khay'ji^Assisting the Consortium^^Consortium Crystal Collection^Speak with Nether-Stalker Khay'ji at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^The naaru of Shattrath City have been trying to find a means to bring the Consortium over to their way of seeing things. Luck would have it that the business relationship between the ethereals and the blood elves of the Netherstorm has recently soured. There's a Consortium representative in town named Nether-Stalker Khay'ji who recently ran into trouble with a pack of renegade ethereals. As a representative of the Aldor, I would like for you to help him in any way that you can.Assisting the Consortium^68^All^Netherstorm^Spymaster Thalodien^Nether-Stalker Khay'ji^Assisting the Consortium^^Consortium Crystal Collection^Speak with Nether-Stalker Khay'ji at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^The naaru of Shattrath City have been trying to find a means to bring the Consortium over to their way of seeing things. Luck would have it that the business relationship between the ethereals and the blood elves of the Netherstorm has recently soured. There's a Consortium representative in town named Nether-Stalker Khay'ji who recently ran into trouble with a pack of renegade ethereals. As a representative of the Scryers, I would like for you to help him in any way that you can.Consortium Crystal Collection^69^All^Netherstorm^Nether-Stalker Khay'ji^Nether-Stalker Khay'ji^Assisting the Consortium^^Pick Your Part^Obtain an Arklon Crystal Artifact and return it to Nether-Stalker Khay'ji at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^Our leader, Nexus-Prince Haramad, has tasked me with the acquisition of a crystal artifact from the Arklon Ruins to the southeast. They're old draenei ruins. Unfortunately for both myself and the goblins here, the Burning Legion has decided to move in to perform their own excavation. If you're willing to help me, go to the ruins and take the crystal artifact from the dreadlord named Pentatharon.Request for Assistance^69^All^Netherstorm^Nether-Stalker Khay'ji^Gahruj^Warp-Raider Nesaad^^^Seek out and offer your services to Gahruj. He is located at the Midrealm Post inside Eco-Dome Midrealm in the Netherstorm.^While you were at the Arklon Ruins, I received a request for assistance from one of our representatives out in the field. It would appear that the Consortium is having some 'difficulties' in trying to recover property from the blood elves, which they refuse to pay for. Please head east out of Area 52 and cross the bridge to the next island over. You'll find my associate, Gahruj, at the Midrealm Post, just inside of Eco-Dome Midrealm.Rightful Repossession^69^All^Netherstorm^Gahruj^Gahruj^Warp-Raider Nesaad^^^Collect 10 Boxes of Surveying Equipment and return them to Gahruj at the Midrealm Post inside Eco-Dome Midrealm in the Netherstorm.^Our business relations with the blood elves appear to be at an end. A few weeks ago a large shipment of surveying equipment was delivered to them at Manaforge Duro. They have refused to pay for it. <name>, I would ask that you pay the blood elves of Manaforge Duro to the east a visit. They appear to be having some trouble with an infestation of mana creatures there, so take advantage of their preoccupation. I care not what happens to them, but I would very much like to see the return of our property.An Audience with the Prince^69^All^Netherstorm^Gahruj^Image of Nexus-Prince Haramad^Warp-Raider Nesaad^^^Deliver the Surveying Equipment to the Image of Nexus-Prince Haramad at the Stormspire in the Netherstorm.^Nexus-Prince Haramad has conveyed to me that he is interested in the immediate return of this property to him personally. I would greatly appreciate if you would deliver it in my stead. It is a great honor to gain an audience with the nexus-prince, and I am sure that he would be keenly interested in hearing the tales of your adventures here in the Netherstorm.
