column2: Illidan Gets...^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Borak
column3: Son of Oronok^Borak
column4: Son of Oronok^The Bundle of Bloodthistle^^^Borak
column5: Son of Oronok at the bridge near Eclipse Point in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to Deliver Illidan's Message to Grand Commander Ruusk at Eclipse Point.^Take this disguise and enter Eclipse Point. Once inside
column6: use the disguise to cloak yourself. The Eclipsion blood elves will be unable to see through the disguise
column7: thereby granting you safe passage to Grand Commander Ruusk. Once you find Ruusk
column8: tell him where next to move the cipher. You're going to have to act your heart out
column9: <name>. Play it off as if you are his superior
column10: delivering a message from his lord. That should do it! Oh - watch out for the dragonhawks as they see through the disguise.

column1: The Cipher of Damnation - Borak's Charge^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Borak
column2: Son of Oronok^Borak
column3: Son of Oronok^The Bundle of Bloodthistle^^^Borak
column4: Son of Oronok at the bridge near Eclipse Point in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to recover the Third Part of the Cipher of Damnation from Ruul the Darkener.^That Cipher fragment will never reach Zuluhed. You're going to ambush Ruul the Darkener and his transport before it has a chance to make the delivery. The Dragonmaw Fortress is directly east of here
column5: across the Netherwing Fields. Somewhere between Dragonmaw Fortress and the Sanctum of the Stars is where you'll find Ruul. Strike hard and strike fast! And <name>
column6: from the sound of it
column7: this Ruul is going to be tough. Keep your guard up. Return the Cipher to me should you succeed.

column1: The Cipher of Damnation - The Third Fragment Recovered^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Borak
column2: Son of Oronok^Oronok Torn-heart^The Bundle of Bloodthistle^^The Cipher of Damnation^Take Borak's Lockbox to Oronok Torn-heart at Oronok's Farm in Shadowmoon Valley.^Take this box to my father. He still resides at Oronok's Farm
column3: far to the north
column4: above Coilskar Cistern. When all three fragments are pieced together
column5: the ancient words will be known once more. Good luck
column6: <name>. Tell my father that I will be home soon.

column1: Where Did Those Darn Gnomes Go?^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Commander Skyshadow^R-3D0^Where Did Those Darn Gnomes Go?^Planting the Banner^^Search the southern area of the Jagged Ridge of the Blade's Edge Mountains for a clue as to the whereabouts of Toshley and the other gnomes.^Despite the good that we've done here
column2: I feel bad about one thing: driving Toshley and his gnome friends away. We had no choice; they were making a mess of our efforts in the grove with all of their technology and experimentation. I would appreciate it if you would find out what became of them. Last we heard
column3: they headed east across the bridge. I'm certain that they must have turned south
column4: away from Thunderlord Stronghold. Look for a clue as to their whereabouts in the southern Jagged Ridge.

column1: Follow the Breadcrumbs^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^R-3D0^Toshley^Where Did Those Darn Gnomes Go?^^Picking Up Some Power Converters^Follow the trail of spare parts up the ramp to the Razor Ridge. Speak with Toshley at Toshley's Station in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^VERY WELL
column2: I AM HEREBY WARNING YOU THAT YOU WILL FIND NOTHING UP ON THE RIDGE. DO NOT FOLLOW THE TRAIL OF SPARE PARTS THAT LEAD TO TOSHLEY'S STATION! YOU WILL NOT FIND TOSHLEY
column3: NOR ANY OTHER GNOME THERE.

column1: Minions of the Shadow Council^69^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Stormer Ewan Wildwing^Stormer Ewan Wildwing^Visions of Destruction^^The Fate of Flanis
column2: The Summoning Chamber^Stormer Ewan Wildwing at the Deathforge Tower wants you to kill 10 Deathforge Guardians and 5 Deathforge Summoners.^<Ewan listens to you recount the events at Legion Hold
column3: nodding.> That puts our observations into perspective. We've caught glimpses of them launching infernals in the direction of the hold
column4: but haven't been able to find much more than that. The Shadow Council has the Deathforge sealed tighter than a new keg o' thunderbrew. The first thing you'll need to do is crack some skulls so you can get in there and poke around. Start eliminating the Shadow Council guarding the entrance to the Deathforge!

column1: The Fate of Flanis^69^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Stormer Ewan Wildwing^Stormer Ewan Wildwing^^Minions of the Shadow Council^Bring Down the Warbringer!^Stormer Ewan Wildwing at Deathforge Tower wants you to search the Deathforge for Flanis Swiftwing and recover Flanis's Pack.^Wing Commander Nuainn originally sent three of us out here to keep watch over the Deathforge and to gather information. Flanis Swiftwing volunteered to try to infiltrate the Deathforge
column2: but we haven't heard anything from him in days. I fear the worst
column3: <name>. Flanis is a skilled scout
column4: but if he's gotten in over his head
column5: we have no way of knowing. Search the Deathforge for him and recover any information or items he might have collected.

column1: Picking Up Some Power Converters^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Toshley^Toshley^Picking Up Some Power Converters^Follow the Breadcrumbs^Ridgespine Menace
column2: Cutting Your Teeth
column3: Test Flight: The Singing Ridge^Use the Protovoltaic Magneto Collector to collect 5 Electromentals.^Those dumb ogres at the Bladespire Outpost to the north have been raiding our power converters! And you're going to get them back for me
column4: sort of. No doubt
column5: with their big
column6: clumsy hands
column7: the ogres have damaged the converters. So
column8: what I want you to do is release the energy from them and then use this protovoltaic magneto collector on the resultant electromental to encase it. It'll likely be sore with you
column9: so you'll need to 'kill' it while it's contained in the magneto sphere.

column1: The Summoning Chamber^69^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Stormer Ewan Wildwing^Stormer Ewan Wildwing^^Minions of the Shadow Council^Bring Down the Warbringer!^Obtain an Elemental Displacer from a Deathforge Smith or Deathforge Tinkerer and use it to disrupt the ritual in the summoning chamber. Report to Stormer Ewan Wildwing at the Deathforge Tower when you've completed your task.^In order for the Shadow Council to construct infernals as quickly as they're being used
column2: they must have an area dedicated to summoning the corrupted elementals that serve as the souls of the creatures. The summoning chamber is likely to be found below ground
column3: near a pool of fouled water or lava. Locate the summoning chamber within the Deathforge and find a way to end their summoning ritual. The mo'arg involved in making the infernals may carry a tool that will help disrupt the summoner's magics.

column1: Bring Down the Warbringer!^69^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Stormer Ewan Wildwing^Wing Commander Nuainn^Bring Down the Warbringer!^The Fate of Flanis
column2: The Summoning Chamber^^Defeat Warbringer Razuun
column3: recover Razuun's Orders
column4: and report to Wing Commander Nuainn at Wildhammer Stronghold.^We've made a lot of progress against the Shadow Council's operations at the Deathforge
column5: but if we're to truly be triumphant
column6: we'll need to defeat the Legion's overseer there. I found a key among the items in Flanis's pack. I'm certain it will prove useful in tracking down this Warbringer Razuun you observed at Legion Hold. After you've hunted down and dealt with Warbringer Razuun
column7: report directly to Wing Commander Nuainn. He'll want to know immediately!

column1: Karabor Training Grounds^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Exarch Onaala^Exarch Onaala^Karabor Training Grounds^^^Exarch Onaala at the Altar of Sha'tar wants you to obtain 8 Sunfury Glaives from Demon Hunter Supplicants and Demon Hunter Initiates at the Ruins of Karabor
column2: southeast of the Altar of Sha'tar.^Our scouts have reported a massive influx of Sunfury blood elf recruits heading to the Ruins of Karabor. Normally this would represent a purely military threat
column3: however we believe something else is amiss. Descriptions of their attire and fighting style are suspiciously close to that of Illidan himself. I do not want to become alarmed without good reason
column4: so I would like you to go there and bring me back their weapons. We will then determine whether my fears are unfounded or not.

column1: The Cipher of Damnation^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Oronok Torn-heart^Earthmender Torlok^^The Cipher of Damnation - The First Frag
column2: The Cipher of Damnation - The Second Fra
column3: The Cipher of Damnation - The Third Frag^The Tempest Key^Use the Cipher of Damnation at the Altar of Damnation to summon Cyrukh the Firelord.^How many times has this spell been used in the history of our worlds? Undoubtedly
column4: its power for destruction is unparalleled. What you must do now is take the cipher
column5: now made whole
column6: and read from it at the Altar of Damnation - where the memory of Gul'dan stands. What you will see once the words are uttered are the memories left imprinted upon the land. Stand your ground and await the coming of Cyrukh. You must be victorious
column7: <name>. This land cannot withstand another shattering.

column1: Gaining Access^69^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Wing Commander Nuainn^Wing Commander Nuainn^Bring Down the Warbringer!^^^Bring a Legion Teleporter Control to Wing Commander Nuainn at Wildhammer Stronghold. The Mo'arg Weaponsmiths at Legion Hold are known to carry the devices.^According to Razuun's orders
column2: the massive infernal staging area is called Invasion Point: Cataclysm and it's nestled in the northern mountains. The only way to reach it is by using a teleporter located at Legion Hold. Certain members of the Legion host carry devices allowing them to activate the teleporters. You must capture one of these devices to win access to the teleporter. Slaughter all of the demons if you must
column3: but you can't afford to return empty-handed.

column1: Prove Your Hatred^52^Horde^Paladin^Mehlar Dawnblade^Mehlar Dawnblade^To The Bulwark^^^Mehlar Dawnblade at the Bulwark wants you to bring him 20 Minion's Scourgestones.^It is time you remembered history that should not be forgotten... the slaughter of our people by Arthas and his Scourge army. Vengeance on the Scourge is the only way to ease your pain. It is unfortunate they are not susceptible to fear and pain. Only their utter destruction will bring you even a shred of satisfaction. Speak with Argent Officer Garush for knowledge of scourgestones and how to obtain them -- I will need to see many of them as proof of your commitment before we speak again.

Wisdom of the Banshee Queen^52^Horde^Paladin^Mehlar Dawnblade^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner^To The Bulwark^^^Bring the Scourgestone Fragments to Lady Sylvanas Windrunner in Undercity.^The scourgestones are weak when separated from the skeletal grasp that once held them. Simply holding them in my hands has caused them to fracture and break. <Mehlar crushes the scourgestones into a pile of rubble.> Take these fragments to the Banshee Queen
column2: Lady Sylvanas Windrunner
column3: at her throne in Undercity. With her lies the knowledge to turn these remains into a weapon against the Scourge.

column1: Ancient Evil^52^Horde^Paladin^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner^Mehlar Dawnblade^To The Bulwark^^^Unlock the secrets of the Temple of Atal'Hakkar to release Atal'alarion and recover the Putrid Vine from his flesh. Return to Mehlar at the Bulwark when you have done this.^If you wish to turn these stones into a weapon to fight the Scourge
column2: you must acquire something equally vile to fortify them. An ancient evil lies hidden at the bottom of the Temple of Atal'Hakkar in the Swamp of Sorrows. Release the creature there and destroy him
column3: taking only a small part of his body back to Mehlar Dawnblade. My guards will deliver the scourgestone fragments to Mehlar.

column1: Gauging the Resonant Frequency^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Nickwinkle the Metro-Gnome^Nickwinkle the Metro-Gnome^Crystal Clear^^^Place the Oscillating Frequency Scanners in such a way that when you stand amongst them
column2: you are hit by 5 overlapping Oscillation fields.^Take these scanners to the Singing Ridge. By dropping them in a pattern on the ground
column3: you will create overlapping fields that will read the amplitude of the crystals. Stand amidst them in such a way that you're in five oscillation fields and I'll have the information that I need! Your scanners will even work with those that others drop. Oh
column4: and it's likely that a rift will be formed! I have no idea what
column5: if anything
column6: will come out of it
column7: but be prepared for the worst.

column1: Besieged!^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Blood Guard Gulmok^Blood Guard Gulmok^Kroghan's Report^^^Blood Guard Gulmok outside of Shadowmoon Village
column2: wants you to kill 10 Infernal Attackers.^<Gulmok looks to the sky.> Our scouts are putting up a good fight
column3: but the infernals keep coming! From their base of Legion Hold to the southwest
column4: the demons bombard us with impunity! Even the elite Kor'kron guard cannot hold them off forever. I'm drafting every able-bodied <race> to do their part in defense of Shadowmoon Village. This is no game
column5: <class>. The survival of the village is at stake. Do your duty to the Horde
column6: and join the fray!

column1: To Legion Hold^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Blood Guard Gulmok^Blood Guard Gulmok^Kroghan's Report^^^Make your way to Legion Hold
column2: locate the Legion Communication Device
column3: and learn about the Legion's plans while in disguise. Return to Blood Guard Gulmok at Shadowmoon Village when you've completed your mission.^The fortress of Legion Hold is your target. You'll have no reinforcements
column4: so a frontal attack is out of the question. What little information we have shows that the Legion stocks and prepares its infernals at the hold. With the help of a disguise I'll give you
column5: you must sneak into Legion Hold and discover their plans. Your best hope is to intercept or overhear communication between their commanders.

column1: Setting Up the Bomb^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Blood Guard Gulmok^Blood Guard Gulmok^Kroghan's Report^^^Obtain a Fel Reaver Power Core and a Fel Reaver Armor Plate
column2: then bring them to Blood Guard Gulmok at Shadowmoon Village.^We can't allow the Legion to trample us on their march to Black Temple. Find a way to destroy the infernals they intend to use against us. That's not a request
column3: <name>; it's an order. The Fetid Pool near Legion Hold holds an old fel reaver power core you could use as the basis for a kind of fel bomb. Search the other wreckage near the fel reaver for a section of armor plating. You should be able to make a bomb powerful enough to take out those infernals and give the hold a nice shake!

column1: Blast the Infernals!^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Blood Guard Gulmok^Blood Guard Gulmok^Kroghan's Report^^^Use the Fel Bomb while standing on the green glyph in Legion Hold to destroy the infernals
column2: then report to Blood Guard Gulmok at Shadowmoon Village.^The device we've assembled won't win any beauty contests
column3: but it should be capable of destroying the infernals amassed at Legion Hold. Judging from what the fel reaver power core's energy did to the Fetid Pool
column4: it holds a respectable amount of explosive power. If you set the device off in the middle of the green glyph at the hold
column5: it should be in range to hit all of the infernals.

column1: The Deathforge^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Blood Guard Gulmok^Scout Zagran^Kroghan's Report^^^Report to Scout Zagran at Slag Watch.^While you were taking care of the infernals at Legion Hold
column2: I've been going over your reports. We've got no reason to believe the Legion lied about what's going on at the Deathforge. They're really cranking out infernals down there
column3: so I've dispatched a scouting party to keep watch over it. If we don't shut down the Deathforge
column4: they'll rebuild the infernal stockpile that you destroyed at Legion Hold. Report to Scout Zagran atop Slag Watch
column5: to the southeast of here and overlooking the Deathforge.

column1: Minions of the Shadow Council^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Scout Zagran^Scout Zagran^Kroghan's Report^^The Fate of Kagrosh
column2: The Summoning Chamber^Scout Zagran at Slag Watch wants you to kill 10 Deathforge Guardians and 5 Deathforge Summoners.^<Zagran listens to you recount the events at Legion Hold
column3: nodding.> That fills in the gaps we've seen. We've caught glimpses of them launching infernals in the direction of the hold
column4: but haven't been able to find much more than that. The Shadow Council has the forge pretty much locked down. Looks like you're going to need to fight your way in. Start eliminating the Shadow Council guarding the entrance to the Deathforge!

column1: The Fate of Kagrosh^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Scout Zagran^Scout Zagran^^Minions of the Shadow Council^Bring Down the Warbringer!^Scout Zagran at Slag Watch wants you to search the Deathforge for Kagrosh and recover Kagrosh's Pack.^The scouting party originally had three members. Unfortunately
column2: Kagrosh decided he wanted to be a hero. He descended into the Deathforge and we haven't heard from him since. In all likelihood
column3: the fool's gone and gotten himself killed. The Shadow Council members aren't idiots and Kagrosh wasn't exactly strong in the subtlety department
column4: if you know what I mean. Keep an eye out for him in the Deathforge and recover any information or items he might have collected.

column1: The Summoning Chamber^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Scout Zagran^Scout Zagran^^Minions of the Shadow Council^Bring Down the Warbringer!^Obtain an Elemental Displacer from a Deathforge Smith or Deathforge Tinkerer and use it to disrupt the ritual in the summoning chamber. Report to Scout Zagran at Slag Watch when you've completed your task.^In order to churn out infernals as quickly as the Deathforge seems to
column2: they must have an area dedicated to summoning the elementals that form the core of the infernals. The summoning chamber is likely to be found below ground
column3: near a pool of fouled water or lava. Locate the summoning chamber within the Deathforge and find a way to end their summoning ritual. The mo'arg involved in making the infernals may carry a tool that will help disrupt the summoner's magics.

column1: Bring Down the Warbringer!^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Scout Zagran^Blood Guard Gulmok^Bring Down the Warbringer!^The Fate of Kagrosh
column2: The Summoning Chamber^^Defeat Warbringer Razuun
column3: recover Razuun's Orders
column4: and report to Blood Guard Gulmok at Shadowmoon Village.^We've made a lot of progress against the Shadow Council here at the Deathforge
column5: but now it's time to finish the job. I found a key among the items in Kagrosh's pack. At least he accomplished something before they got to him. The key should help you to track down this Warbringer Razuun you observed at Legion Hold. After you've hunted down and dealt with Warbringer Razuun
column6: report directly to Blood Guard Gulmok. We must not keep him waiting.

column1: Gaining Access^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Blood Guard Gulmok^Blood Guard Gulmok^Bring Down the Warbringer!^^^Bring a Legion Teleporter Control to Blood Guard Gulmok at Shadowmoon Village. The Mo'arg Weaponsmiths at Legion Hold are known to carry the devices.^According to Razuun's orders
column2: the massive infernal staging area is called Invasion Point: Cataclysm and it's located in the mountains behind our village! The only way to reach it is by using a teleporter at Legion Hold. Certain Legion minions carry a device allowing them to use the teleporter. You must capture one of these devices to win access to the teleporter. Slaughter all of the demons if you must
column3: but you can't afford to return empty-handed. Do not delay; the enemy is perilously close.

column1: Carendin Summons^20^All^Warlock^Alamma^Carendin Halgar^Carendin Summons^^^Speak with Carendin Halgar in Undercity.^You have a hungry look about you
column2: <name>. Perhaps it is time you advanced your training. Travel to Undercity and speak with Carendin Halgar
column3: the old bag of bones knows a trick or two you might find useful.

column1: The Art of Fel Reaver Maintenance^69^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Plexi^Plexi^Bring Down the Warbringer!^^^Kill Doctor Gutrick and obtain the Doctor's Key. Use the key to open the Doctor's Strongbox to retrieve The Art of Fel Reaver Maintenance and deliver the book to Plexi at Invasion Point: Cataclysm.^The best way to destroy the rest of the Legion's supplies is to use their own weapons against them. I've been working on a rig that will let you take control of one of those Fel Reaver Sentinels below. There are a couple things I need to work out
column2: yet. For that
column3: I'll need the manual that Doctor Gutrick keeps locked in a chest at the bottom of the ramp. He probably won't give up the key without a fight
column4: so you'll need to capture it. Bring the fel reaver manual back to me and I'll do the rest!

column1: Whispers of the Raven God^68^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Timeon^Timeon^Creating the Pendant^^^Kill Grishna arakkoa to gain Understanding Ravenspeech for 2 minutes. While under the effects of the spell
column2: you can find and receive the prophecy from the four shrines.^At Grishnath
column3: totems left by the Oracles of the Raven enable the arakkoa to hear the Word of the Raven. Unfortunately
column4: the language of the arakkoa is indecipherable to us. Using the Harbinger's pendant
column5: we can understand it. You will be able to take the souls of the arakkoa to understand their language. While you are suffused with the arakkoa's spirit
column6: you can visit the totems and understand their message. Discover this for us
column7: <name>.

column1: Crystal Clear^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Nickwinkle the Metro-Gnome^Nickwinkle the Metro-Gnome^Crystal Clear^^^Slay 10 Crystal Flayers.^The damned rock flayers are keeping me from my research down in the Singing Ridge! By digging at the crystals there
column2: with every scratch they are ruining my chances of studying the harmonics of the singing crystals. You look like someone who can help me deal with this problem. Head south and clear those crystal flayers out.

column1: What Came First
column2: the Drake or the Egg?^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Fizit "Doc" Clocktock^Fizit "Doc" Clocktock^^^^Collect 3 Proto-Nether Drake Essences
column3: 3 Adolescent Drake Essences and 3 Mature Drake Essences.^I'm researching the applications of drake essences to my work as a physician. I think they could be a panacea for a host of maladies! I need someone to go south to the Singing Ridge and get me some. Willing to take my temporal phase modulator and use it on the nether whelps that hatch from the nether drake eggs? Retrieve the essences from whatever they turn into. Which
column4: I might add
column5: I'm not certain of what that will be as we're using some pretty dicey
column6: time and space modifying tech here.

column1: The Art of Fel Reaver Maintenance^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Nakansi^Nakansi^Bring Down the Warbringer!^^^Kill Doctor Maleficus and obtain the Doctor's Key. Use the key to open the Doctor's Strongbox to retrieve The Art of Fel Reaver Maintenance and deliver the book to Nakansi at Invasion Point Cataclysm.^The best way to destroy the rest of the Legion's supplies is to use their own weapons against them. I've been working on a rig that will let you take control of one of those Fel Reaver Sentinels below. There are a couple things I need to work out
column2: yet. For that
column3: I'll need the manual that Doctor Maleficus keeps locked in a chest near the bottom of the ramp. He probably won't give up the key without a fight
column4: so you'll need to capture it. Bring the fel reaver manual back to me and I'll do the rest.

column1: The Fel and the Furious^69^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Plexi^Plexi^Bring Down the Warbringer!^^^Use a Fel Reaver Control Console to take control of a Fel Reaver Sentinel. Destroy 60 Deathforged Infernals before your fel reaver fails. When your mission is complete
column2: report to Plexi at Invasion Point: Cataclysm.^<Plexi leafs through the manual.> Well
column3: this has everything we need
column4: but there's just one problem. Fel Reavers aren't really built to respond to remote control. We can modify one for you to use for a short time
column5: but you'll have to work fast
column6: or there's no telling what might happen! I wouldn't be surprised if your little stunt with the fel reaver catches the attention of the Legion's lackeys
column7: either. Keep an eye out
column8: and whatever you do
column9: don't forget to destroy as much as you can!

column1: The Fel and the Furious^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Nakansi^Nakansi^Bring Down the Warbringer!^^^Use a Fel Reaver Control Console to take control of a Fel Reaver Sentinel. Destroy 60 Deathforged Infernals before your fel reaver fails. When your mission is complete
column2: report to Nakansi at Invasion Point: Cataclysm.^<Nakansi leafs through the manual.> All the information is here
column3: but be warned. These things weren't built to be controlled remotely. We can modify one for you to use for a short time
column4: but you'll have to work fast
column5: or there's no telling what might happen! I wouldn't be surprised if your little stunt with the fel reaver catches the attention of the Legion scum
column6: either. Try to keep yourself safe
column7: but remember
column8: the mission and the safety of Shadowmoon Village come first!

column1: Whispers on the Wind^66^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Rexxar^Leoroxx^The Spirits Have Voices^^^Speak with Leoroxx at the Mok'Nathal Village in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^I have chased rumors of the Mok'Nathal across Outland with nothing to show for it. Finally
column2: we may have found their home. But now that the moment is here
column3: I am filled with unease. Unease that has kept me awake deep into the nights during my search. Will they accept me? I... know their leader's name: Leoroxx. Seek him out. You must be my eyes in this.

column1: Ruuan Weald^64^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Dertrok^Timeon^Trial and Error^^^Speak with Timeon at Evergrove
column2: which is in the Ruuan Weald in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^The information you have helped me reveal about the nature of the arakkoa here will be of great interest to another. We were visited by members of the Cenarion Expedition
column3: who have also become concerned with the arakkoa's intentions here in the Blade's Edge Mountains. You should seek him out. His name is Timeon
column4: and you will find him at Evergrove in Ruuan Weald. Follow the road west from here
column5: then north when it forks in Razor Ridge. Finally
column6: follow the road west when it splits in the Bladed Gulch.

column1: Silkwing Cocoons^66^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Taerek^Taerek^^^^Collect 8 Silkwing Cocoons from Silkwing Larva.^The silk from the cocoons of the silkwings are used for all manner of things in the village. We can never get enough
column2: and we never have enough. It is difficult to harvest the cocoons from the larva once they begin the process of metamorphosis. Our warriors are occupied with the assault on our village. If you could gather these for us
column3: that would be helpful.

column1: The Softest Wings^65^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Silmara^Silmara^^^^Collect 12 Iridescent Wings.^Hunting silkwing larva is a difficult challenge for our young warriors
column2: but luckily
column3: even if they fail to harvest the cocoon from the larva
column4: we can still use the wings of hatched silkwings. In fact
column5: we use the wings for much more than the cocoons
column6: and we can never have too many. If you'll be out there
column7: it would be a great help if you could bring me some.

column1: The Ashtongue Tribe^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Vindicator Aluumen^Vindicator Aluumen^The Ashtongue Tribe^^Reclaiming Holy Grounds^Vindicator Aluumen wants you to go to the Ruins of Baa'ri and slay 3 Ashtongue Handlers
column2: 4 Ashtongue Warriors and 6 Ashtongue Shaman.^The Ashtongue tribe is feared among all Broken. It consists of the most vicious and bloodthirsty individuals
column3: handpicked by Akama himself. They are as fierce and ruthless as any naga
column4: demon or blood elf in Illidan's army and they have been deployed in large numbers at the Ruins of Baa'ri
column5: southwest of here. Go there and put a dent in their numbers before they get a chance to mount an attack on us.

column1: Ridgespine Menace^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Dizzy Dina^Dizzy Dina^^Picking Up Some Power Converters^More than a Pound of Flesh^Slay 10 Ridgespine Stalkers.^We hired on to help Toshley when he decided to move to Outland
column2: and we've been on the move ever since. Now it looks like we've finally put down some roots. All of the crazy scientists have their projects going
column3: and us Roughriders are here to protect them. What we need right now is for you to go north into Razor Ridge
column4: or east to the Scalewing Shelf
column5: and keep them clear by killing the stalkers. They're stealthy spiders that live amongst the rock outcroppings
column6: and jump unsuspecting passersby.

column1: Illidari-Bane Shard^69^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Illidari-Bane Shard^Ordinn Thunderfist^Illidari-Bane Shard^^^Bring the Illidari-Bane Shard to Ordinn Thunderfist at Wildhammer Stronghold.^The shard appears to be a piece of a larger weapon. Sharp-looking runes etched into the metal glow with a menacing light. The weapon's intended purpose isn't clear to you
column2: but it's hard to ignore. Most of the mo'arg at Legion Hold seem to be working with fragments of the same metal you hold in your hand. Perhaps one of the weaponsmiths at Wildhammer Stronghold might be able to tell you more about it.

column1: Proof of Allegiance^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Sanoru^Sanoru^Tablets of Baa'ri^^^Slay Zandras at the Warden's Cage in Shadowmoon Valley and return to Sanoru.^Akama has been tracking your progress quite closely
column2: <name>. The Ashtongue you've slain at the Ruins of Baa'ri are amongst the most evil Broken known among us... carefully hand-picked by Akama himself to maintain the facade we need to present to Illidan. The Deathsworn
column3: however
column4: know of Akama's true intentions. First things first. We need to know that you are not with Illidan. A Satyr known as Zandras watches over us from above the prison walls on his behalf. Slay him as proof of your allegiance.

column1: Illidari-Bane Shard^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Illidari-Bane Shard^Grokom Deatheye^Illidari-Bane Shard^^^Bring the Illidari-Bane Shard to Grokom Deatheye at Shadowmoon Village.^The shard appears to be a piece of a larger weapon. Sharp-looking runes etched into the metal glow with a menacing light. The weapon's intended purpose isn't clear to you
column2: but it's hard to ignore. Most of the mo'arg at Legion Hold seem to be working with fragments of the same metal you hold in your hand. Perhaps one of the weaponsmiths at Shadowmoon Village might be able to tell you more about it.

column1: A Haunted History^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Chief Apothecary Hildagard^Chief Apothecary Hildagard^Chief Apothecary Hildagard^^^Chief Apothecary Hildagard at Shadowmoon Village in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to bring her 15 Ever-burning Ash samples.^Have you felt the cold chill? Perhaps what you thought was a hand on your shoulder? That was not your mind playing tricks on you
column2: <race>. The land is haunted. Ghosts litter the landscape
column3: stuck here for all eternity. Would you like to see them? Are you sure about that? These types of things tend to change a person - and not for the better. Very well
column4: I will need you to collect for me the ever-burning ash that is found near any of the fel lava pools of western Shadowmoon. Anywhere near green lava...

column1: Spectrecles^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Chief Apothecary Hildagard^Chief Apothecary Hildagard^Chief Apothecary Hildagard^^^Chief Apothecary Hildagard at Shadowmoon Village in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to slay 12 Shadowmoon Zealots.^I call them "Spectrecles." Clever
column2: no? When you equip these goggles
column3: you will be able to see the spirits of Shadowmoon Valley. Before I let you have them
column4: though
column5: you must promise me that you will help us clear out the ghosts at the village. Take the goggles and destroy any and all spirits that you see wandering about Shadowmoon Village. Hopefully
column6: destroying these spirits will force any that remain to move elsewhere.

column1: Capture the Weapons^69^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Ordinn Thunderfist^Ordinn Thunderfist^Illidari-Bane Shard^^The Hermit Smith^Ordinn Thunderfist at Wildhammer Stronghold wants you to bring him Mazakradon's Glaive and Morgroron's Glaive.^With a larger supply of this material
column2: we might be able to forge a weapon for you to use. The two pit lords at Legion Hold
column3: Makazradon and Morgroron
column4: have already been equipped with these anti-demon weapons. We have no way of knowing how many more the Legion intends to produce
column5: but if we can capture these prototypes
column6: there should be enough for our project. <Ordinn grins.> There's a certain amount of satisfaction in using the Legion's own 'secret weapons' against them
column7: don't you think?

column1: Capture the Weapons^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Grokom Deatheye^Grokom Deatheye^Illidari-Bane Shard^^The Hermit Smith^Grokom Deatheye at Shadowmoon Village wants you to bring him Mazakradon's Glaive and Morgroron's Glaive.^With a larger supply of this material
column2: I can forge a weapon suitable for you. The two pit lords at Legion Hold
column3: Makazradon and Morgroron
column4: have already been equipped with these anti-demon weapons. Capturing those two weapons should provide us with enough material to make your weapon
column5: and then some. I can't wait to bring the battle to the enemy using these weapons. That'll teach the Legion to trifle with anti-demon magics.

column1: Akama^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Sanoru^Akama^Tablets of Baa'ri^^Seer Udalo^Speak to Akama inside the hidden chamber in the Warden's Cage.^You've proven what side you're on. I will reveal to you our leader's hideout. Follow the halls beyond; there will be an underground passage hidden by stagnant water on your right. I must warn you
column2: <name>. You are not to speak to anyone of what you see there.

column1: Shizz Work^61^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Foreman Razelcraz^Foreman Razelcraz^Outland Sucks!^^^Use the Felhound Whistle to summon a Fel Guard Hound. Take the Fel Guard Hound for a walk and kill some Deranged Helboars. Search for the Shredder Keys in the Fel Guard Hound's "leavings." Return the Shredder Keys to Foreman Razelcraz by the mine northwest of Thrallmar.^I finally got my shredder working but I seem to have lost the keys. I keep a pack of felhounds to protect my camp. They don't do a very good job and they like to bite me a lot. They also like shiny things. I think this one felhound I have may have eaten my shredder keys. I'll pay you if you'll take my felhound on a walk. Kill some helboars and let him eat. He'll do his business. When he's done
column2: see if you can't find the keys in his "leavings."

column1: Beneath Thrallmar^61^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Foreman Razelcraz^Foreman Razelcraz^Outland Sucks!^^^Kill Urga'zz and return to Foreman Razelcraz by the mine northwest of Thrallmar.^I'm almost back in business. Problem is all these gan'arg are in my mine. I can't send my peons in and even once I fix this shredder I wouldn't want to risk it in combat. Deep down in the mine the gan'arg have a leader. If you kill him maybe the gan'arg will leave. Then I could make some money and buy my way out of here.

Cutting Your Teeth^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Razak Ironsides^Razak Ironsides^^Picking Up Some Power Converters^^Collect 5 Extra Sharp Daggermaw Teeth.^It's nice that you've been helping out Toshley and his scientists. I
column2: however
column3: do not have the luxury of indulging in my 'personal' interests. If you want to make a difference around here
column4: you'll do what I ask of you
column5: and right now
column6: I need weapons. Our guns are effective at range
column7: but when the bugs get in close
column8: we need to have powerful melee weapons as a backup. The teeth of the daggermaw lashtails in the northern part of the Razor Ridge make for great vibro-weapon blades. Scare me up some.

column1: Teron Gorefiend - Lore and Legend^70^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Chief Apothecary Hildagard^Ancient Shadowmoon Spirit^Chief Apothecary Hildagard^^Divination: Gorefiend's Armor
column2: Divination: Gorefiend's Cloak^Chief Apothecary Hildagard at Shadowmoon Village in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to find the Ancient Shadowmoon Spirit.^Stories abound about the life of Teron Gorefiend
column3: but most are just that - stories. We do not know what happened to Gorefiend after he returned to Draenor. The only thing we are certain of is that he has already died once. I have heard the scouts here speaking of an ancient orc spirit that resides at the Altar of Shadows
column4: far to the southeast
column5: across the Netherwing Fields and through Netherwing Pass. Take the Spectrecles and track this orc down. He will surely have more information on Gorefiend.

column1: Divination: Gorefiend's Armor^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Ancient Shadowmoon Spirit^Ancient Shadowmoon Spirit^^Teron Gorefiend - Lore and Legend^Teron Gorefiend
column2: I am...
column3: Teron Gorefiend
column4: I am...^The Ancient Shadowmoon Spirit at the Altar of Shadows in southeast Shadowmoon Valley wants you to recover Gorefiend's Armor.^In life
column5: Gorefiend was a monster
column6: but in death
column7: Gorefiend was an unmitigated terror. To the southeast you will find Netherwing Ledge. What was once part of the mainland of Shadowmoon is now a floating island in the sky. Vhel'kur
column8: spawn of Deathwing
column9: once called it his home
column10: but now knows it as his grave. He flies an endless circle above the island
column11: seething at his defeat to Gorefiend. If you are to recover the Gorefiend's armor
column12: it is Vhel'kur that you must defeat.

column1: Divination: Gorefiend's Cloak^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Ancient Shadowmoon Spirit^Ancient Shadowmoon Spirit^^Teron Gorefiend - Lore and Legend^^The Ancient Shadowmoon Spirit at the Altar of Shadows in southeast Shadowmoon Valley wants you to recover Gorefiend's Cloak.^Many a cruel act he committed but none so cold as the slaughter of the clerics of Karabor. After Gul'dan's Horde defeated the draenei of Karabor
column2: the surviving clerics of Karabor were marched out
column3: told that they were to be taken to Hellfire Citadel as prisoners of war. Gorefiend
column4: not yet a death knight
column5: murdered each and every last one of them in cold blood. They now roam in front of the Black Temple with vengeance in their hearts. It is the clerics of Karabor that hold the cloak of Gorefiend.

column1: Divination: Gorefiend's Truncheon^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Ancient Shadowmoon Spirit^Ancient Shadowmoon Spirit^^^^The Ancient Shadowmoon Spirit at the Altar of Shadows in southeast Shadowmoon Valley wants you to recover Gorefiend's Truncheon.^One by one they knelt before him
column2: offering their lives as a show of allegiance. Gorefiend hoisted his sickle and cut clean their heads. Shortly after this slaughter
column3: Gorefiend took his own life. But this was no act of contrition! No
column4: Gorefiend sought immortality! From the corpses of the fallen death knights rose the Ghostriders of Karabor. They now ride the roads encircling the Hand of Guldan
column5: awaiting the day that their master returns. It is they who hold the truncheon of Gorefiend. Retrieve it...

column1: A Necessary Distraction^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Exarch Onaala^Exarch Onaala^Karabor Training Grounds^^^Exarch Onaala wants you to return to the Ruins of Karabor and find a way to unleash Azaloth on his captors.^The weapons are authentic
column2: as we feared. Illidan is training demon hunters at the Ruins of Karabor and we must put an end to it. Do not be fooled by their name
column3: <name>
column4: their power will be used against us as often as against any demon. Their warlocks summon and subdue demons to be used as part of the initiates' training. A pit lord named Azaloth has proven too strong to be used in training and is kept banished. Find a way to let him loose on his captors. That should buy us the time we need.

column1: Teron Gorefiend
column2: I am...^70^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Ancient Shadowmoon Spirit^Chief Apothecary Hildagard^^Divination: Gorefiend's Armor^^The Ancient Shadowmoon Spirit has used you as a pawn! Now that you have collected the items he required
column3: he has revealed himself to be Teron Gorefiend. To break free of his possession
column4: you must do his bidding and slay Karsius the Ancient Watcher.^With Gorefiend's items restored
column5: there is but one last piece to this puzzle: A host. <The ancient shadowmoon spirit's lips curl up to form a wicked grin.> Surely you did not believe the fairy tale that I told you. The Altar of Shadows is my prison. Without your help
column6: I would have been stuck here for all eternity. Now
column7: I will take over your body and you will destroy my captors and break these bonds. Refuse and we will both be stuck here forever. Teron Gorefiend will be free!

column1: Altruis^70^All^Nagrand^Exarch Onaala^Altruis the Sufferer^Karabor Training Grounds^^Against the Illidari
column2: Against All Odds^Travel to western Nagrand and find Altruis the Sufferer.^It is rare in this day and age to hear of those who follow the path of the demon hunter. It is rarer still to find someone who does and has no allegiance to Illidan. There are rumors of one such individual here in Outland. One name is said to be feared in the Legion fields of Nagrand more than any army of Aldor vindicators. That name is Altruis. Go to western Nagrand and find him. He might be willing to shed some light on these new demon hunter training grounds.

column1: Against the Legion^70^All^Nagrand^Altruis the Sufferer^Altruis the Sufferer^^Forge Camp: Annihilated^Illidan's Pupil^Altruis the Sufferer wants you to obtain Freshly Drawn Blood from a Wrath Priestess at Forge Base: Gehenna in Netherstorm. Spill it on the ground and slay the Avatar of Sathal. Return to Altruis when you've completed this task.^The Burning Legion has proven its capacity to corrupt mortal souls time and again. If I'm to entrust you with the knowledge you seek
column2: I must have proof of your allegiance. A demoness known as Sathal has eluded me for a long time as she's gifted with an incorporeal form. She watches over the wrath priestesses as they do her bidding at Forge Base: Gehenna. Slay one of her minions and spill her blood on the ground. This affront should cause Sathal to materialize temporarily. Slay her while you can.

column1: A Ghost in the Machine^69^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Zorus the Judicator^Zorus the Judicator^Zorus the Judicator^^^Zorus the Judicator at Wildhammer Stronghold in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to bring him 15 Ever-burning Ash samples.^I fear that these dwarves do not understand what they have built upon. This area was once the ancestral grounds for the Shadowmoon orcs. I speak of spirits
column2: <race>. For nearly twenty years they have laid dormant beneath the Wildhammer Stronghold
column3: but recently
column4: something has riled them up. Venture beyond the gates of Wildhammer and seek out the pools and rivers of fel lava found across this land. Near the lava will be ever-burning ash. Bring me this ash so that I may craft something that will help us.

column1: Harbingers of Shadowmoon^69^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Zorus the Judicator^Zorus the Judicator^Zorus the Judicator^^^Zorus the Judicator at Wildhammer Stronghold in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to slay 12 Shadowmoon Harbingers.^Let it be known that Zorus does have a sense of humor. Enough small talk. Don the Spectrecles so that you are able to see the Shadowmoon orc spirits that wander this stronghold. Do not be frightened as we are truly the invaders here. Alas
column2: they must be destroyed
column3: for their time has long since passed. Destroy the Shadowmoon harbingers infesting Wildhammer Stronghold and return to me.

column1: Teron Gorefiend - Lore and Legend^70^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Zorus the Judicator^Ancient Shadowmoon Spirit^Zorus the Judicator^^Divination: Gorefiend's Armor
column2: Divination: Gorefiend's Cloak^Zorus the Judicator at Wildhammer Stronghold in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to find the Ancient Shadowmoon Spirit.^Stories abound about the life of Teron Gorefiend
column3: but most are just that - stories. We do not know what happened to Gorefiend after he returned to Draenor. The only thing we are certain of is that he has already died once. I have heard the scouts here speaking of an ancient orc spirit that resides at the Altar of Shadows
column4: far to the east
column5: across the Netherwing Fields and through Netherwing Pass. Take the Spectrecles and track this orc down. He will surely have more information on Gorefiend.

column1: Teron Gorefiend
column2: I am...^70^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Ancient Shadowmoon Spirit^Zorus the Judicator^^Divination: Gorefiend's Armor^^The Ancient Shadowmoon Spirit has used you as a pawn! Now that you have collected the items he required
column3: he has revealed himself to be Teron Gorefiend. To break free of his possession
column4: you must do his bidding and slay Karsius the Ancient Watcher.^With Gorefiend's items restored
column5: there is but one last piece to this puzzle: A host. <The ancient shadowmoon spirit's lips curl up to form a wicked grin.> Surely you did not believe the fairy tale that I told you. The Altar of Shadows is my prison. Without your help
column6: I would have been stuck here for all eternity. Now
column7: I will take over your body and you will destroy my captors and break these bonds. Refuse and we will both be stuck here forever. Teron Gorefiend will be free!

column1: Illidan's Pupil^70^All^Nagrand^Altruis the Sufferer^Altruis the Sufferer^Illidan's Pupil^Against the Legion
column2: Against the Illidari
column3: Against All Odds^^Listen to Altruis's story.^You've proven your allegiance
column4: <name>. You must forgive my caution
column5: but in this world things are not what they appear. I will tell you about Varedis when you're ready.

column1: Wanted: Uvuros
column2: Scourge of Shadowmoon^70^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Wanted Poster^Warcaller Sardon Truslice^^^^Slay Uvuros and recover Uvuros's Fiery Mane. Return it to Warcaller Sardon Truslice at Shadowmoon Village in Shadowmoon Valley.^Wanted - DEAD: Uvuros
column3: scourge of Shadowmoon Valley. By order of Overlord Or'barokh
column4: the fel beast
column5: Uvuros
column6: is to be killed on sight and his mane stripped from his carcass as proof of deed. Return the fiery mane of the beast to Warcaller Sardon Truslice should you succeed. Uvuros was last seen at the Hand of Gul'dan
column7: located in the heart of Shadowmoon Valley - east of Shadowmoon Village.

column1: Wanted: Uvuros
column2: Scourge of Shadowmoon^70^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Wanted Poster^Warcaller Beersnout^^^^Slay Uvuros and recover Uvuros's Fiery Mane. Return it to Warcaller Beersnout at Wildhammer Stronghold in Shadowmoon Valley.^Wanted - DEAD: Uvuros
column3: scourge of Shadowmoon Valley. By order of Thane Yoregar
column4: the fel beast
column5: Uvuros
column6: is to be killed on sight and his mane stripped from his carcass as proof of deed. Return the fiery mane of the beast to Warcaller Beersnout should you succeed. Uvuros was last seen at the Hand of Gul'dan
column7: located in the heart of Shadowmoon Valley - northeast of Wildhammer Stronghold.

column1: The Book of Fel Names^70^All^Nagrand^Altruis the Sufferer^Altruis the Sufferer^Illidan's Pupil^^Return to the Aldor
column2: Return to the Scryers^Venture inside the Shadow Labyrinth in Auchindoun and obtain the Book of Fel Names from Blackheart the Inciter. Return to Altruis in Nagrand once you've completed this task.^I sympathize with your intentions of stopping Varedis and his followers
column3: but you won't stand a chance against him. That is
column4: unless you find the artifact that gave him his power. The Book of Fel Names is rumored to be in the possession of Blackheart the Inciter inside the Shadow Labyrinth in Auchindoun. Obtaining it will be your only hope against Varedis.

column1: Return to the Aldor^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Altruis the Sufferer^Exarch Onaala^Return to the Aldor^The Book of Fel Names^^Speak with Exarch Onaala at the Altar of Sha'tar in Shadowmoon Valley.^This book... I could use it to increase my power tenfold... No! It would end up corrupting my very soul
column2: this I am sure of. Return to those who sent you here
column3: <name>. You now have the means to stop Varedis. Wait until he manifests his demonic form through metamorphosis
column4: at that point you will need to burn the book in his presence. That will be the only way you can deprive him of his power.

column1: Varedis Must Be Stopped^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Exarch Onaala^Exarch Onaala^Return to the Aldor^^^Exarch Onaala wants you to go to the ruins of Karabor and slay Alandien
column2: Theras
column3: Netharel and Varedis. Use the Book of Fel Names when Varedis uses Metamorphosis to weaken him. Return to Exarch Onaala with the Book of Fel Names after you've completed this task.^We must dispose of this foul artifact
column4: but not before we use it to dispose of Varedis's powers. We need to permanently shut down the Ruins of Karabor training grounds
column5: which will mean killing not only Varedis but also the three night elf masters that assist him: Alandien
column6: Theras and Netharel. Gather a suitable force and return to the Ruins of Karabor. Follow Altruis's instructions for defeating Varedis. For all of our sakes
column7: I hope they work.

column1: Behind Enemy Lines^69^All^Netherstorm^Veronia^Caledis Brightdawn^Report to Spymaster Thalodien^^^Speak to Veronia when you're ready to depart to Manaforge Coruu. Once there
column2: speak to Caledis Brightdawn.^All arrangements have been made to take you to where our spies are hiding. Just come see me when you're ready and we'll get you on your way.

column1: Marks of Sargeras^70^All^Shattrath City^Adyen the Lightwarden^Adyen the Lightwarden^^^More Marks of Sargeras
column2: Single Mark of Sargeras^Bring 10 Marks of Sargeras to Adyen the Lightwarden in Shattrath City.^By now it should be clear to you why we oppose the Burning Legion and those who serve them. If you wish to prove yourself to the Aldor
column3: bring me the insignias of high-ranking Legion and their Shadow Council followers. The highest-ranking Legion can be found in Netherstorm and Shadowmoon Valley.

column1: Sunfury Signets^70^All^Shattrath City^Magistrix Fyalenn^Magistrix Fyalenn^^^More Sunfury Signets
column2: Single Sunfury Signet^Magistrix Fyalenn in Shattrath City wants you to bring her 10 Sunfury Signets.^As you might know
column3: the Scryers and the armies of Kael'thas are at war. Kael sees us as a threat to his influence over other blood elves and has tried to crush us time and again. If you wish to aid us in our battle against Kael'thas
column4: there are plenty of targets for you to go after. Kael's highest ranking soldiers wear Sunfury signets to mark their ranks. You will find them all over Netherstorm and Shadowmoon Valley.

column1: Ride the Lightning^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Toshley^Toshley^Picking Up Some Power Converters^^^Use the Repolarized Magneto Sphere to absorb 25 lightning strikes from the Scalewing Serpents. Also
column2: collect 5 Scalewing Lightning Glands.^We haven't kept the use of the Zephyrium Capacitorium under budget. But
column3: it occurs to me that the serpents of the Scalewing Shelf to the east have a lightning breath and glands that we can make use of. I've repolarized the magneto collector to absorb lightning strikes and I want you to head up there
column4: activate it on yourself
column5: and get us some cheap fuel from those serpents.

column1: What Strange Creatures...^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Researcher Tiorus^Researcher Tiorus^What Strange Creatures...^^^Researcher Tiorus at Shadowmoon Village in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to recover 8 Felfire Spleens.^I am interested in learning more about the strange reptiles that mill about the lava flows of Shadowmoon Valley. Never have I seen beasts able to withstand the searing heat of molten lava! Outside of Shadowmoon Village
column2: where the ground has ruptured and lava flows through the cracks
column3: you will find felfire diemetradons. Slay them and bring me their spleens. From their spleens I will be able to begin preliminary analysis of their resistance to heat. Begin your search to the southeast.

column1: Spleendid!^69^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Gnomus^Gnomus^Spleendid!^^^Gnomus at Wildhammer Stronghold in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to recover 8 Felfire Spleens.^Have you ever heard of food that cooks itself and stays hot forever? Dare to dream
column2: I say! But maybe it's not a dream at all! Outside the fortress
column3: near the lava pools and streams
column4: you can find beasts that thrive in the sizzling heat. They're called felfire diemetradons. The dwarves around here tell me that those diemetradons have the tastiest spleens ever and that the spleens practically come pre-cooked! Bring me those spleens and I'll give you some coin. Start your search directly east of here.

column1: The Hermit Smith^69^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Ordinn Thunderfist^David Wayne^The Hermit Smith^Capture the Weapons^Additional Materials^Bring the Box of Ingots to David Wayne at Wayne's Refuge in Terokkar Forest.^<Ordinn examines the results from his attempt at smithing the metal and shakes his head.> This is beyond my ability
column2: but that's not to say the weapon can't be recreated for your use. There was a talented smith who accompanied the Sons of Lothar to Draenor
column3: David Wayne. He was a remarkable blacksmith
column4: but chose to leave the expedition. These days
column5: he lives in a small camp on a peninsula east of Firewing Point in Terokkar Forest. Take the ingots to him and see if he can help you with the weapon.

column1: The Hermit Smith^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Grokom Deatheye^David Wayne^The Hermit Smith^Capture the Weapons^Additional Materials^Bring the Box of Ingots to David Wayne at Wayne's Refuge in Terokkar Forest.^<The orc shakes his head at his failure.> This is beyond my ability
column2: but that's not to say the weapon can't be recreated. It pains me to suggest this
column3: but your only hope may be a human smith by the name of David Wayne. It's true he was once a member of the Alliance's expedition
column4: but that was a long time ago and he has since left the Sons of Lothar. These days
column5: he lives in a small camp on a peninsula east of Firewing Point in Terokkar Forest. Take the ingots to him and see if he can help you.

column1: Additional Materials^69^All^Shadowmoon Valley^David Wayne^David Wayne^The Hermit Smith^^Fresh from the Mechanar
column2: The Lexicon Demonica^David Wayne at Wayne's Refuge wants you to bring him an Adamantite Frame
column3: 4 Heavy Knothide Leather
column4: and a Demon Warding Totem.^The ingots that you brought contain most of the metal I'll need to forge the sword's blade
column5: but I'll need a variety of things to create other parts of the weapon. Let's see
column6: among the things I don't have here are an adamantite frame
column7: some heavy knothide leather
column8: and a demon warding totem. Skilled crafters should be able to produce the first two
column9: but the third is only sold by the reagent vendor in Shattrath's Lower City
column10: Fantei. You'll find him with the other tradesmen.

column1: Fresh from the Mechanar^69^All^Shadowmoon Valley^David Wayne^David Wayne^^Additional Materials^Underworld Loam
column2: Tear of the Earthmother^David Wayne at Wayne's Retreat wants you to bring him an Overcharged Manacell.^Working with the ingots you brought is going to require a lot of heat -- rather more than a conventional forge can supply. I'm going to need a supplemental heat source for the forge and there are very few things in Outland that can supply that kind of power. The Mechanar area of Tempest Keep turns out manacells containing an incredible amount of power. Find one of the overcharged manacells from the stacks around Mechano-Lord Capacitus and bring it back here.

column1: The Lexicon Demonica^69^All^Shadowmoon Valley^David Wayne^David Wayne^^Additional Materials^Underworld Loam
column2: Tear of the Earthmother^Obtain the Lexicon Demonica from Grandmaster Vorpil and bring it to David Wayne at Wayne's Refuge.^Recreating the enchantments on the blade requires several spells to be spoken in demonic. It's not something I was taught during my training as an apprentice
column3: but there's no way around it. There's a book
column4: called the Lexicon Demonica
column5: that will provide most of the words I need
column6: but it's in the hands of a powerful Shadow Council warlock. Deep in the halls of Auchindoun's Shadow Labyrinth
column7: it is held by Grandmaster Vorpil. Do whatever you must to secure the book and bring it to me.

column1: Underworld Loam^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^David Wayne^David Wayne^^Fresh from the Mechanar
column2: The Lexicon Demonica^Bane of the Illidari^Get a Vial of Underworld Loam from Hydromancer Thespia and bring it to David Wayne at Wayne's Refuge.^The frame that you brought me earlier will not be sufficient to hold molten metal without reinforcement. A rare kind of earth can be used to cool and imbue the frame
column3: giving the adamantite an unnatural strength. Underwold loam
column4: as the earth is known
column5: is accorded great value among the naga. Few enough of them possess it
column6: and in Outland
column7: I know of only one naga who uses it -- Hydromancer Thespia
column8: who resides in the Steamvault of Coilfang Reservoir.

column1: Against the Illidari^70^All^Nagrand^Altruis the Sufferer^Altruis the Sufferer^^Altruis^Illidan's Pupil^Altruis the Sufferer wants you to slay Lothros at Illidari Point in Shadowmoon Valley.^I still have respect for Illidan. Without him I would not have found my path. He is not who he once was
column2: however. His soul has been corrupted by power
column3: his mind has been twisted by defeat. He has become what I am sworn to destroy and his pet servants
column4: the Illidari
column5: are as much of an abomination as any demon of the Burning Legion. His grasp on Outland is slipping yet his reach is still vast. Prove you're not with him by slaying his lieutenant Lothros at Illidari Point in Shadowmoon Valley.

column1: Against All Odds^70^All^Nagrand^Altruis the Sufferer^Altruis the Sufferer^^Altruis^Illidan's Pupil^Altruis the Sufferer wants you to take the Imbued Silver Spear and use it at Portal Clearing near Marshlight Lake in Zangarmarsh to awake Xeleth. Return to Altruis after you've slain the demon.^Some demons pledge allegiance to no one but themselves. A true enemy of demons finds and destroys his prey regardless of affiliation
column2: however. The demon Xeleth - a Legion defector - was once worshipped as a god by primitive swamp creatures in Zangarmarsh. When Draenor was nearly destroyed
column3: he retreated into a slumber deep beneath Marshlight Lake. Find the portal at the lake and plant this spear into the ground. Xeleth will awake - be ready to slay him and prove you're an enemy to all demons.

column1: Tear of the Earthmother^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^David Wayne^David Wayne^^Fresh from the Mechanar
column2: The Lexicon Demonica^Bane of the Illidari^Recover the Tear of the Earthmother from Warbringer O'mrogg and return it to David Wayne at Wayne's Refuge.^The sword's enchantments must be contained within a powerful focus
column3: such as a gem. I know of a gem that we can use for this purpose
column4: for there are few that can play host to such powerful magics without shattering. The gem we need is called the tear of the earthmother. It's a powerful artifact in the hands of the ogres who created it
column5: and Warbringer O'mrogg
column6: who currently holds the gem
column7: has many powerful allies in Hellfire Citadel's Shattered Halls. Take care in retrieving the tear
column8: <name>.

column1: More than a Pound of Flesh^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Dizzy Dina^Dizzy Dina^^Ridgespine Menace^^Collect 5 Ether-Energized Flesh.^<name>
column2: I've got something else for you to do. One of the eggheads wants to study the fiendling flesh beasts that can be found at Razaan's Landing
column3: north of the Razor Ridge. More to the point
column4: they want to study the flesh of the flesh beasts that are there. <Dizzy makes a disgusted face.> But
column5: of course
column6: they aren't willing to get their hands dirty
column7: and they only want the ether-energized flesh
column8: which it's not likely that all of them have. I say
column9: beggars can't be choosers
column10: but what can you do?

column1: Frankly
column2: It Makes No Sense...^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Researcher Tiorus^Researcher Tiorus^What Strange Creatures...^^^Researcher Tiorus at Shadowmoon Village in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to travel to the lava flow near the Ruins of Baa'ri and use the Arcano Control Unit to control an Arcano-Scorp
column3: swim in the lava with the Arcano-Scorp
column4: and tag 8 Greater Felfire Diemetradons.^We must study these creatures further. Far to the east - near the huge lava flow beneath the ruins of Baa'ri - you will find arcano control units. These controllers were crafted by a genius named Gnomus for the sole purpose of exploring lava via mechanical scorpion. He has long since lost his mind and is now only interested in eating the hottest food known to gnome-kind. <Tiorus gives you a funny look.> I want you to use the control and tag the diemetradons of the lava flow for further study.

column1: Felspine the Greater^70^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Researcher Tiorus^Researcher Tiorus^What Strange Creatures...^^^Researcher Tiorus at Shadowmoon Village in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to kill Felspine the Greater and recover Felspine's Hide.^Gnomus knows about the massive diemetradon and plans to eat it! He must have been able to see what I could see through the eyes of his arcano-scorp. Look
column2: there's no time to explain. He's crazy and that craziness is going to cost us the closest thing we've got to a fireproof jumpsuit. Get back to the lava flow near Baa'ri and track down Felspine the Greater. Once you find it
column3: kill it and bring me back its hide. Don't try and reason with me
column4: <name>. I'm well past that point.

column1: Trapping the Light Fantastic^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Toshley^Toshley^Picking Up Some Power Converters^^^Use the Light Trap to collect 15 Razaani Light Orbs.^The Razaani ethereals have been playing with some interesting technology at Razaan's Landing to the north. I'm sure they won't mind if you use this trap to take a few samples of their little pink floating light orbs? They're probably only for decoration anyway. The trap has a special property to it that when opened should attract one of the floating balls towards it. Of course
column2: it'll probably also alert the Razaani to your presence.

column1: Show Them Gnome Mercy!^68^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Toshley^Toshley^Picking Up Some Power Converters^^^Collect the Collection of Souls.^<The blood drains out of Toshley's face.> These orbs are made up of both nether energy and souls
column2: some of them gnome souls! How dare they! Were they the ones killing our people that traveled north?! <name>
column3: you must put a stop to this
column4: and the only way to do that is to finish off their leader
column5: Nexus-Prince Razaan. You'll have to coax him out of hiding though. I'm guessing that you can do that by killing a lot of his Razaani ethereal. Bring me the collection of souls that he no doubt has.

column1: Bane of the Illidari^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^David Wayne^David Wayne^Bane of the Illidari^Underworld Loam
column2: Tear of the Earthmother^^Wait for David Wayne to finish forging a sword for you.^<David gathers his smithing supplies.> You've done well in getting everything we'll need to reforge the anti-demon blade. Your hard work and dedication is about to be repaid. The time has come to forge the sword.

column1: The Second Course...^69^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Gnomus^Gnomus^Spleendid!^^^Gnomus at Wildhammer Stronghold in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to recover 1 Overdeveloped Felfire Gizzard.^I remember seeing larger diemetradons east of the Hand of Gul'dan
column2: near the lava flows around the Ruins of Baa'ri. What I want you to get for me now is one overdeveloped felfire gizzard from the beasts around that area. You might have to kill several to find a gizzard like the one I described. Keep at it! One of them is bound to have my next meal.

column1: The Main Course!^70^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Gnomus^Gnomus^Spleendid!^^^Gnomus at Wildhammer Stronghold in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to recover Felspine's Hide.^Long story short
column2: I used to work with a blood elf named Tiorus. My partnership with Tiorus dissolved once I got into gourmet living. He decided to take it upon himself to continue our research using MY inventions. Anyhow
column3: he had some of his Horde goons using my arcano-scorp probes at the Ruins of Baa'ri lava flow and discovered the mother of all diemetradons! I need you to get there before he does and kill the diemetradon
column4: Felspine
column5: and bring his hide back to me. Hurry up!

column1: Quenching the Blade^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^David Wayne^David Wayne^Bane of the Illidari^^^Travel to the Scalding Pools located near the top of the Hand of Gul'dan and use the Forged Illidari-Bane Blade to quench it in the lava pools. Once you have the Quenched Illidari-Bane Blade
column2: return to David Wayne at Wayne's Refuge.^The blade is nearly finished! You can almost feel the magic beginning to coalesce inside the steel
column3: but one thing remains to be done. You must take the forged blade to the Scalding Pools near the top of the Hand of Gul'dan in Shadowmoon Valley and plunge it into the lava pools to quench the sword. When you have quenched the sword
column4: return.

column1: The Hand of Gul'dan^70^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Earthmender Sophurus^Earthmender Torlok^The Hand of Gul'dan^^Enraged Spirits of Fire and Earth^Speak with Earthmender Torlok at the Altar of Damnation in Shadowmoon Valley.^The elements need your help
column2: <race>! Shadowmoon Valley has been subject to unspeakable evils. The spirits remain tortured to this day. Many are enraged and unwilling to commune with the Earthen Ring. Help this world heal
column3: friend. Directly northeast of Wildhammer Stronghold you will find an area known as the Altar of Damnation. Make your way there and speak with Earthmender Torlok.

column1: The Hand of Gul'dan^70^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Earthmender Splinthoof^Earthmender Torlok^The Hand of Gul'dan^^Enraged Spirits of Fire and Earth^Speak with Earthmender Torlok at the Altar of Damnation in Shadowmoon Valley.^The elements need your help
column2: <race>! Shadowmoon Valley has been subject to unspeakable evils. The spirits remain tortured to this day. Many are enraged and unwilling to commune with the Earthen Ring. Help this world heal
column3: friend. Southeast of Shadowmoon Village - in the heart of Shadowmoon Valley - you will find an area known as the Altar of Damnation. Make your way there and speak with Earthmender Torlok.

column1: A Time for Negotiation...^67^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Tree Warden Chawn^Tree Warden Chawn^A Time for Negotiation...^^Poaching from Poachers^Negotiate with Overseer Nuaar.^When we arrived in the Ruuan Weald
column2: the wyrm cultists were keeping themselves to Blackwing Coven
column3: through the tunnel to the west. But now
column4: they are encroaching upon us here. I need you to find the wyrmcultists' overseer. He's known to make a regular patrol between their various camps in the Ruuan Weald. Negotiate with him. Let him know that there's room for compromise
column5: but that we will not condone or allow the wholesale slaughter of the wildlife
column6: nor the felling of all of the trees.

column1: Tablets of Baa'ri^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Arcanist Thelis^Arcanist Thelis^Tablets of Baa'ri^^Oronu the Elder^Arcanist Thelis at the Sanctum of the Stars wants you to collect 12 Baa'ri Tablets from the ground and from Ashtongue Workers at the Ruins of Baa'ri.^The Ashtongue Broken have been ordered by Illidan to excavate the Ruins of Baa'ri
column2: to the far north. They're in search of draenei artifacts
column3: no doubt - Baa'ri was home to many Baa'ri relics before Gul'dan buried the town under a volcanic explosion. We must use this opportunity to recover the Tablets of Baa'ri
column4: an ancient text rumored to hold the secrets of the Temple of Karabor... a place you might know as the Black Temple.

column1: Oronu the Elder^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Arcanist Thelis^Arcanist Thelis^Tablets of Baa'ri^^^Arcanist Thelis at the Sanctum of the Stars wants you to obtain the Orders from Akama from Oronu the Elder at the Ruins of Baa'ri.^According to the tablets
column2: an artifact known as a Medallion of Karabor was kept at Baa'ri. Only the highest-ranking draenei priests were granted these
column3: as they allowed unfettered access into the Temple of Karabor. We must find out whether the Ashtongue have recovered the medallion that was kept at Baa'ri yet. Its power would provide great aid in our fight against Illidan. Akama's lieutenant at Baa'ri
column4: Oronu the Elder
column5: receives written orders from him daily. Obtain them and bring them to me.

column1: The Ashtongue Corruptors^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Arcanist Thelis^Arcanist Thelis^Tablets of Baa'ri^^^Obtain the four medallion fragments from Haalum
column2: Eykenen
column3: Lakaan and Uylaru and return to Arcanist Thelis at the Sanctum of the Stars in Shadowmoon Valley.^According to Akama's letter
column4: four fragments of the medallion were unearthed and given to the Ashtongue Corruptors. These dreaded Broken were once powerful shaman who now defile the very elements they revered. Haalum
column5: Corruptor of Air
column6: can be found at Netherwing Pass. Eykenen and Uylaru
column7: Corruptors of Earth and Fire
column8: were last seen at the Fel Pits near the Hand of Gul'dan. Lakaan
column9: Corruptor of Water
column10: is rumored to be near Coilskar Point. Find them and obtain the medallion fragments.

column1: The Warden's Cage^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Arcanist Thelis^Sanoru^Tablets of Baa'ri^^Proof of Allegiance^Arcanist Thelis wants you to enter the Warden's Cage
column2: south of the Ruins of Baa'ri and interrogate Sanoru on Akama's whereabouts.^The fragments you obtained are only half of the medallion. The Ashtongue leader
column3: Akama
column4: must have kept the other half. I dread to ask this of you
column5: as Akama is both evil and cunning. He and the Ashtongue Deathsworn - the vilest and most brutal of the tribe - are rumored to run a torture chamber inside the Warden's Cage. I want you to find that dreaded prison
column6: and find the whereabouts of Akama. His second in command at the location is a Broken known as Sanoru - interrogate him if you have to.

column1: Karabor Training Grounds^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Larissa Sunstrike^Larissa Sunstrike^Karabor Training Grounds^^^Larissa Sunstrike at the Sanctum of the Stars wants you to obtain 8 Sunfury Glaives from the Demon Hunter Supplicants and Demon Hunter Initiates at the Ruins of Karabor
column2: northeast of the Sanctum of the Stars.^Our scouts have reported a massive influx of Sunfury blood elf recruits heading to the Ruins of Karabor. Normally this would represent a purely military threat
column3: however we believe something else is amiss. Descriptions of their attire and fighting style are suspiciously close to that of Illidan himself. I do not want to become alarmed without good reason
column4: so I would like you to go there and bring me back their weapons. We will then determine whether my fears are unfounded or not.

column1: A Necessary Distraction^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Larissa Sunstrike^Larissa Sunstrike^Karabor Training Grounds^^^Larissa Sunstrike wants you to return to the Ruins of Karabor and find a way to unleash Azaloth on his captors.^The weapons are authentic
column2: as we feared. Illidan is training demon hunters at the Ruins of Karabor and we must put an end to it. Do not be fooled by their name
column3: <name>
column4: their power will be used against us as often as against any demon. Their warlocks summon and subdue demons to be used as part of the initiates' training. A pit lord named Azaloth has proven too strong to be used in training and is kept banished. Find a way to let him loose on his captors. That should buy us the time we need.

column1: Altruis^70^All^Nagrand^Larissa Sunstrike^Altruis the Sufferer^Karabor Training Grounds^^Against the Illidari
column2: Against All Odds^Travel to western Nagrand and find Altruis the Sufferer.^You don't see many demon hunters nowawdays. They're viewed with suspicion by their own people and it's very rare to find one that doesn't have some sort of allegiance to Illidan. There are rumors of one such demon hunter out in Nagrand. His name is Altruis. He hates all demons with a passion and will help us if you can convince him that you share his goals. Go to western Nagrand and find him. He might be willing to shed some light on these new demon hunter training grounds.

column1: The Den Mother^66^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Wanted Poster^Commander Skyshadow^^^^Slay Rema.^WANTED! Rema
column2: the den mother and primary defender of the Jagged Ridge south of Thunderlord Stronghold. Find her by heading east out of town and across the bridge that traverses the Bloodmaul Ravine. She keeps herself secluded in the tunnel at the southern edge of the ridge. Return with news of her demise to Commander Skyshadow of Sylvanaar.

column1: Return to the Scryers^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Altruis the Sufferer^Larissa Sunstrike^Return to the Scryers^The Book of Fel Names^^Speak with Larissa Sunstrike at the Sanctum of the Stars in Shadowmoon Valley.^This book... I could use it to increase my power tenfold... No! It would end up corrupting my very soul
column2: this I am sure of. Return to those who sent you here
column3: <name>. You now have the means to stop Varedis. Wait until he manifests his demonic form through metamorphosis
column4: at that point you will need to burn the book in his presence. That will be the only way you can deprive him of his power.

column1: Varedis Must Be Stopped^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Larissa Sunstrike^Larissa Sunstrike^Return to the Scryers^^^Larissa Sunstrike wants you to go to the ruins of Karabor and slay Alandien
column2: Theras
column3: Netharel and Varedis. Use the Book of Fel Names when Varedis uses Metamorphosis to weaken him. Return to Larissa Sunstrike with the Book of Fel Names after completing this task.^Of course we must destroy this book
column4: but not before we use it to destroy Varedis. If we're to shut down this academy of Illidan imitators
column5: we'll have to deal not just with Varedis but also the three night elf masters that assist him: Alandien
column6: Theras and Netharel. Gather a suitable force and return to the Ruins of Karabor. Follow Altruis's instructions for defeating Varedis. Hopefully his plan will work - otherwise... it'll have been a pleasure working with you.

column1: Breaking Down Netherock^68^All^Netherstorm^Wanted Poster^Rocket-Chief Fuselage^^^^Slay Netherock and then report in with Rocket-Chief Fuselage at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^To whomever cares about the timely construction of the X-52 Nether-Rocket -- The king of the local mountain giants
column2: Netherock
column3: has been terrorizing the Crumbling Wastes. He's been interfering with operations all along the south ledge of the island! Take your friends and deal with him! Then
column4: return to me here in Area 52. Rocket-Chief Fuselage

column1: A Grunt's Work...^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Overlord Or'barokh^Overlord Or'barokh^^^^Overlord Or'barokh at Shadowmoon Village in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to kill 20 Shadowmoon Valley Wildlife.^All Horde forces in this region have been dispatched to handle the attacks from the Burning Legion. This means that we are short-handed for grunt work. Our supply caravans are in constant danger from the wildlife of the region. We can't veer 15 feet off the road without running into a chimaera
column2: felboar
column3: or abnormally large scorpion. Get out there and clear Shadowmoon Valley of its sadistic wildlife! Just kill 'em all!

column1: Put On Yer Kneepads...^69^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Thane Yoregar^Thane Yoregar^^^^Thane Yoregar at Wildhammer Stronghold in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to kill 20 Shadowmoon Valley Wildlife.^It's time to get down in the muck and get dirty. What were you expectin'? You gotta learn to walk before you can crawl
column2: right? Er
column3: reverse that... Anyway
column4: we got all hands on deck fer killin' the garbage being thrown at us by the Burning Legion. That leaves you with the honor of cleaning up the crazed wildlife of Shadowmoon Valley. Grab a sword
column5: staff
column6: whatever it is that makes you happy
column7: and kill as much of the wildlife as you can see. That'll clear a way out for our supply caravans!

column1: How to Break Into the Arcatraz^70^All^Tempest Keep^A'dal^A'dal^Special Delivery to Shattrath City^^^A'dal has tasked you with the recovery of the Top and Bottom Shards of the Arcatraz Key. Return them to him
column2: and he will fashion them into the Key to the Arcatraz for you.^A message was embedded in the ata'mal crystal that you recovered. Nexus-Prince Haramad has given us information vital to our campaign against Tempest Keep. He tells us that there are two pieces
column3: shards to a key
column4: which
column5: when combined
column6: will unlock the keep's Arcatraz satellite. One half is possessed by an ancient in the Botanica known as Warp Splinter. The other is held by Pathaleon the Calculator inside the Mechanar. Bring both shards to me and I will combine them into the Arcatraz key.

column1: Seer Udalo^70^All^Tempest Keep^Akama^Udalo^Seer Udalo^Akama^^Find Seer Udalo inside the Arcatraz in Tempest Keep.^I hope you're not shocked when I reveal to you that the pieces of the Medallion of Karabor you obtained from my minions are mere replicas. <Akama shows you an identical medallion in his open palm.> My Deathsworn and I have kept the secret from Illidan for as long as possible. We are however
column2: still missing the final piece. Udalo came to me in dreams to announce he had found it. Unfortunately he is held by Kael'thas inside the Arcatraz in Tempest Keep. Find him and see what he knows.
