column1: A Mysterious Portent^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Udalo^Akama^Seer Udalo^^^Return to Akama at the Warden's Cage in Shadowmoon Valley.^Before he died
column2: Udalo appears to have written a single word on the floor beneath him. The writing is barely legible but you recognize the word Atam'al. Perhaps Akama will understand the meaning of his brethren's message.

column1: The Ata'mal Terrace^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Akama^Akama^Seer Udalo^^Akama's Promise^Go to the top of the Ata'mal Terrace in Shadowmoon Valley and obtain the Heart of Fury. Return to Akama at the Warden's Cage in Shadowmoon Valley when you've completed this task.^It has been known to us that the fel orcs
column2: under Illidan's command
column3: have guarded an Ata'mal crystal known as the Heart of Fury at the Ata'mal Terrace. They cloud its presence with dark magic
column4: to keep it from the Sha'tar. Fight your way to the Ata'mal Terrace outside the Black Temple and turn your eyes to the sky. Shadowlord Deathwail will circle the terrace
column5: beyond your reach. You will have to slay him and his warlocks before you can obtain the crystal. It won't be easy
column6: <name>. I wish you luck.

column1: Akama's Promise^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Akama^A'dal^^The Ata'mal Terrace^The Secret Compromised^Bring the Medallion of Karabor to A'dal in Shattrath City.^<Akama inserts the crystal into the medallion in his hand.> I am not as strong as I once was
column2: <name>. Being so close to evil itself all these years - I do not know if I can trust myself with an artifact as powerful as this. Take this as my promise to you that when the time comes and you face Illidan
column3: I will be on your side. Take it to the one being we know we can trust with its power. Take the medallion to A'dal in Shattrath City.

column1: Reunion^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Leoroxx^Rexxar^The Spirits Have Voices^^^Speak with Rexxar at Thunderlord Stronghold in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^So you come from the world beyond the Portal? And you know of Rexxar. Oh yes
column2: I am quite familiar with him. You see
column3: he is my son. But he made his choice a lifetime ago. He is not one of us
column4: and he is not welcome here. We have enough troubles with the Bloodmaul ogres. Know this: being born a half-breed does not make you Mok'Nathal.

column1: Test Flight: The Singing Ridge^64^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Tally Zapnabber^Tally Zapnabber^Test Flight: The Zephyrium Capacitorium^Picking Up Some Power Converters^Test Flight: Razaan's Landing^Sign Tally's Waiver
column2: then speak with Rally Zapnabber to use the Zephyrium Capacitorium.^I've been fiddling with the Zephyrium Capicitorium and I'm ready to perform another test! Do you want to help? This next flight should be short
column3: but fast! Um... and although I'm sure there's no danger... I have this
column4: uh
column5: waiver that I'd like you to sign. It's just a formality
column6: I assure you! Best of luck! Talk to Rally to launch yourself
column7: and come back to me after the experiment is over!

column1: Test Flight: Razaan's Landing^64^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Tally Zapnabber^Tally Zapnabber^^Test Flight: The Singing Ridge^Test Flight: Ruuan Weald^Speak with Rally Zapnabber to use the Zephyrium Capacitorium.^<name>
column2: I raised the efficiency of the Zephyrium Capacitorium by 30 percent. That will launch a test subject of your weight and wind drag ratio to new heights! Want to test my theory? This experiment ought to send you near Razaan's Landing. Speak with Rally... he'll get you prepared for launch.

column1: Test Flight: Ruuan Weald^64^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Tally Zapnabber^O'Mally Zapnabber^^Test Flight: Razaan's Landing^^Speak with Rally Zapnabber to use the Zephyrium Capacitorium. While flying to Ruuan Weald
column2: spin the Nether-weather Vane. Deliver the Spinning Nether-weather Vane to O'Mally Zapnabber in Evergrove.^Hey
column3: <name>. I'm glad I caught you! I have a very important mission! Here is a nether-weather vane. I need you to take some in flight readings for me and deliver them to my cousin in Ruuan Weald. Speak with Rally and take a Zephyrium Capacitorium flight to Ruuan Weald. While you're flying
column4: spin the vane! After you land
column5: bring the spinning vane to O'Mally Zabnabber. Good luck
column6: <name>. And don't delay!

column1: ...and a Time for Action^67^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Tree Warden Chawn^Tree Warden Chawn^A Time for Negotiation...^^^Slay 10 Wyrmcult Hewers.^We will not stand idly by while they decimate the Ruuan Weald around us. Our first priority must be to the trees. <class>
column2: I want you to go back out into the Weald and deliver a very different message for us. I want you to slay every one of their hewers that you come into contact with! If they will not listen to reason
column3: perhaps they will listen to a more assertive method of persuasion!

column1: On Spirit's Wings^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Rexxar^Rexxar^The Spirits Have Voices^^^Find a Bloodmaul Taskmaster and a Bloodmaul Soothsayer engaged in conversation
column2: then use Rexxar's Whistle to summon Spirit to spy on them.^If the Mok'Nathal are tormented by the Bloodmaul ogres
column3: then I will stop them and their followers. Ogres are simple creatures
column4: and there is little profit they could gain from harassing the Mok'Nathal. There must be something more to this. <name>
column5: take Spirit
column6: my hawk
column7: and spy upon the conversations of the Bloodmaul's leaders. He may go undetected where we cannot.

column1: Into the Churning Gulch^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Baron Sablemane^Baron Sablemane^The Spirits Have Voices^^Baron Sablemane's Poison^Collet 7 Crust Burster Venom Glands.^So
column2: your Rexxar would have me fashion a poison for him? I'll give him what he desires
column3: but there will be a price. Even for friends
column4: there must be a price. Free things destroy friendships. First
column5: you must venture a short distance to the southwest to the Churning Gulch. Therein mill some of the most poisonous creatures in all of Outland
column6: or anywhere. I speak of the crust bursters
column7: and this poison will require gathering their glands for me.

column1: Test Flight: Raven's Wood^64^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Tally Zapnabber^ ^^^^Speak with Rally Zapnabber to use the Zephyrium Capacitorium. Return to Tally Zapnabber at Toshley's Station.^The Zephyrium Capacitorium is ready for its longest launch yet! What do you say
column2: <name>? Do you want to fly one more time? I've been boosting the proplusion system but
column3: until I get all the variables hammered out
column4: the capicitorium will need added fuel to give it the necessary kick! Speak with Rally before the flight -- he has the details. Best of luck
column5: <name>. This flight will take you to distant Raven's Wood. If you survive the flight -- and the wood's ogres and arakkoa -- come back and we'll celebrate!

column1: Poaching from Poachers^67^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Samia Inkling^Samia Inkling^Poaching from Poachers^A Time for Negotiation...^^Collect 5 Wyrmcult Nets.^Pardon me
column2: but I couldn't help but overhear your conversation with Chawn. I'd like to help. I'm studying the Blackwing Coven
column3: and helping the druids in their dealings with them. I am very interested in acquiring a few of their dragon whelps; it would help us to gauge exactly what we're up against by understanding that which they revere. But first
column4: we're going to need to acquire some nets. I noticed that the wyrmcult poachers out in the Ruuan Weald have an abundance of them.

column1: The Spirits Have Voices^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Garm Wolfbrother^Rexxar^The Spirits Have Voices^The Thunderspike^^Speak with Rexxar at Thunderlord Stronghold in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^<name>
column2: now that you can see me
column3: there is something you must tell Rexxar. I know that he seeks his people
column4: and I know where they are. The Mok'Nathal
column5: as they are known
column6: have a village to the east beyond the Razor Ridge. Go
column7: give Rexxar this news. His people are in danger
column8: and I know that he will want to come to their aid.

column1: Did You Get The Note?^67^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Meeting Note^Tree Warden Chawn^^^Wyrmskull Watcher^Deliver the Meeting Note to Tree Warden Chawn at Evergrove in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^The cultist dropped this note
column2: which apparently was to be delivered to Overseer Nuaar. It is signed by someone named Kolphis Darkscale. It is likely that Tree Warden Chawn will be interested in looking at this.

column1: The Smallest Creatures^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Rexxar^Rexxar^Baron Sablemane's Poison^^^Use the Kodohide Drum at the Marmot Den. While controlling the Marmot
column2: poison the three kegs in the Bloodmaul Camp.^The ogres
column3: simple as they are
column4: would notice you dispersing this poison throughout their camp. Thus
column5: I will teach you how to enlist the help of one of nature's smallest creatures to do this task. By playing a simple rhythm on this drum
column6: you can coax a marmot to follow your commands. There is a den of marmots near the Bloodmaul camp
column7: to the north
column8: down in the Daggermaw Canyon past the Circle of Blood. Once you have a marmot's aid
column9: use it to disperse the poison to the Bloodmaul's kegs.

column1: A Boaring Time for Grulloc^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Rexxar^Baron Sablemane^Baron Sablemane's Poison^^^Collect Grulloc's Sack.^<name>
column2: I have a pet boar named Huffer. He wants to help you to have some fun with one of the nearby sons of Gruul. Grulloc inhabits a place known as the Cursed Hollow. When you get there
column3: let Huffer loose. The gronn will have a fine time chasing him around
column4: and you will retrieve the bag that he guards and deliver it to Baron Sablemane. To get to the Cursed Hollow
column5: head down the northern ramp and east through Dragons' End. The hollow is on the eastern edge.

column1: Meeting at the Blackwing Coven^68^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Watcher Moonshade^Tree Warden Chawn^Wyrmskull Watcher^^^Collect enough Costume Scraps from wyrmcultists to create an Overseer Disguise. Use the disguise to attend the meeting with Kolphis Darkscale.^I know what must be done! <name>
column2: you must pose as Overseer Nuaar and attend that meeting! The wyrmcultists at the coven all have a standard outfit that they wear
column3: so go collect scraps from them
column4: and when you have enough
column5: put together a disguise. Pose as Overseer Nuuar and speak with Kolphis Darkscale to see what he has to say
column6: and then return to Tree Warden Chawn. You'll find the coven by heading through the Wyrmskull Tunnel and following the path past the Raven's Wood and Grishnath to its end.

column1: Gorgrom the Dragon-Eater^68^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Rexxar^Rexxar^Baron Sablemane's Poison^^^Collect 3 Grisly Totems from the Boulder'mok ogres. Then
column2: use Sablemane's Trap at Gorgrom's Altar to set the trap and summon and kill Gorgrom the Dragon-Eater.^The gronn we seek is Gorgrom the Dragon-Eater. With Sablemane's trap
column3: you will make short work of the gronn. You will find him accepting sacrifices from the ogres of Boulder'mok. Follow the road north from the Circle of Blood
column4: then west at Ruuan Weald. Go northwest through the tunnel. First
column5: kill the ogres for their heads. We will send a message. Set the trap at his altar. When he is dead
column6: plant the grisly totems near him - none can mistake that message. Take the bear. <Misha growls.>

column1: Prisoner of the Bladespire^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Rexxar^Rexxar^Baron Sablemane's Poison^^^Slay Bladespire ogres to get the Wyvern Cage Key. Once you have it
column2: go to the Wyvern Cage and use Spirit's Whistle to summon Spirit
column3: who will unlock the cage to free Leokk.^Shortly after my arrival in the mountains
column4: I came under attack by a group of Bladespire ogres. Though I fought free of them
column5: and slew many
column6: they took my wyvern
column7: Leokk
column8: captive. Spirit has found him
column9: locked in a cage in the heart of the Bladespire encampment outside of Gruul's lair. One of the ogres must carry his key. Find it and Spirit can use it to unlock Leokk's cage. You will find the encampment at the north end of the Daggermaw Canyon down below.

column1: Eminence Among the Violet Eye^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Archmage Leryda^Archmage Leryda^Down the Violet Path^^Archmage No More^Bring your Violet Signet to Archmage Leryda at Deadwind Pass after obtaining Exalted reputation with the Violet Eye.^Your services have gone above and beyond what is expected of you
column2: <name>. You are but a step away from achieving the highest honor available to non-citizens of Dalaran. Continue to prove your loyalty to us and I will empower your signet to its full capacity.

column1: Eminence Among the Violet Eye^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Archmage Leryda^Archmage Leryda^Down the Violet Path^^Restorer No More^Bring your Violet Signet to Archmage Leryda at Deadwind Pass after obtaining Exalted reputation with the Violet Eye.^Your services have gone above and beyond what is expected of you
column2: <name>. You are but a step away from achieving the highest honor available to non-citizens of Dalaran. Continue to prove your loyalty to us and I will empower your signet to its full capacity.

column1: Eminence Among the Violet Eye^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Archmage Leryda^Archmage Leryda^Down the Violet Path^^Assassin No More^Bring your Violet Signet to Archmage Leryda at Deadwind Pass after obtaining Exalted reputation with the Violet Eye.^Your services have gone above and beyond what is expected of you
column2: <name>. You are but a step away from achieving the highest honor available to non-citizens of Dalaran. Continue to prove your loyalty to us and I will empower your signet to its full capacity.

column1: Eminence Among the Violet Eye^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Archmage Leryda^Archmage Leryda^Down the Violet Path^^Protector No More^Bring your Violet Signet to Archmage Leryda at Deadwind Pass after obtaining Exalted reputation with the Violet Eye.^Your services have gone above and beyond what is expected of you
column2: <name>. You are but a step away from achieving the highest honor available to non-citizens of Dalaran. Continue to prove your loyalty to us and I will empower your signet to its full capacity.

column1: Down the Violet Path^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Archmage Leryda^Archmage Leryda^Down the Violet Path^^^Bring your Violet Signet to Archmage Leryda at Deadwind Pass after obtaining Honored reputation with the Violet Eye.^You've chosen your path
column2: <class>. Now it is up to you to travel the path to wherever it may lead. You will find that having friends among the Archmages of Dalaran has its advantages. Serve us well and your deeds will not go unrewarded.

column1: Down the Violet Path^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Archmage Leryda^Archmage Leryda^Down the Violet Path^Path of the Violet Restorer^^Bring your Violet Signet to Archmage Leryda at Deadwind Pass after obtaining Honored reputation with the Violet Eye.^You've chosen your path
column2: <class>. Now it is up to you to travel the path to wherever it may lead. You will find that having friends among the Archmages of Dalaran has its advantages. Serve us well and your deeds will not go unrewarded.

column1: Down the Violet Path^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Archmage Leryda^Archmage Leryda^Down the Violet Path^Path of the Violet Assassin^^Bring your Violet Signet to Archmage Leryda at Deadwind Pass after obtaining Honored reputation with the Violet Eye.^You've chosen your path
column2: <class>. Now it is up to you to travel the path to wherever it may lead. You will find that having friends among the Archmages of Dalaran has its advantages. Serve us well and your deeds will not go unrewarded.

column1: Down the Violet Path^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Archmage Leryda^Archmage Leryda^Down the Violet Path^Path of the Violet Protector^^Bring your Violet Signet to Archmage Leryda at Deadwind Pass after obtaining Honored reputation with the Violet Eye.^You've chosen your path
column2: <class>. Now it is up to you to travel the path to wherever it may lead. You will find that having friends among the Archmages of Dalaran has its advantages. Serve us well and your deeds will not go unrewarded.

column1: Distinguished Service^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Archmage Leryda^Archmage Leryda^Down the Violet Path^^^Bring your Violet Signet to Archmage Leryda at Deadwind Pass after obtaining Revered reputation with the Violet Eye.^You have not disappointed us
column2: <name>. We continue to have very high hopes for you
column3: however. Continue to serve the Violet Eye and you will be appropriately rewarded.

column1: Distinguished Service^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Archmage Leryda^Archmage Leryda^Down the Violet Path^^^Bring your Violet Signet to Archmage Leryda at Deadwind Pass after obtaining Revered reputation with the Violet Eye.^You have not disappointed us
column2: <name>. We continue to have very high hopes for you
column3: however. Continue to serve the Violet Eye and you will be appropriately rewarded.

column1: Distinguished Service^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Archmage Leryda^Archmage Leryda^Down the Violet Path^^^Bring your Violet Signet to Archmage Leryda at Deadwind Pass after obtaining Revered reputation with the Violet Eye.^You have not disappointed us
column2: <name>. We continue to have very high hopes for you
column3: however. Continue to serve the Violet Eye and you will be appropriately rewarded.

column1: Distinguished Service^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Archmage Leryda^Archmage Leryda^Down the Violet Path^^^Bring your Violet Signet to Archmage Leryda at Deadwind Pass after obtaining Revered reputation with the Violet Eye.^You have not disappointed us
column2: <name>. We continue to have very high hopes for you
column3: however. Continue to serve the Violet Eye and you will be appropriately rewarded.

column1: Showdown^70^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Rexxar^Rexxar^Baron Sablemane's Poison^^^Use Rexxar's Battle Horn at the Altar of Goc
column2: then kill Goc.^Now it comes to this. We will bring Goc forth from his lair
column3: and we will destroy him. With Goc dead
column4: the Bladespire ogres will threaten the Mok'Nathal no longer. Go to Goc's altar outside Gruul's Lair
column5: then blow my horn. I will come
column6: and we will face the son of Gruul together.

column1: News of Victory^70^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Plexi^Kurdran Wildhammer^Bring Down the Warbringer!^^^Return to Wildhammer Stronghold and speak with Kurdran Wildhammer.^You must bring word of our success to Kurdran Wildhammer immediately! His men
column2: under Wing Commander Nuainn
column3: have fought nonstop to keep Wildhammer Stronghold safe and your return will surely bolster their spirits. With the threat from the Legion out of the way
column4: Kurdran can finally turn his attention to dealing with the forces of Illidan. Our place here is far from secure
column5: but we've won a major victory this day.

column1: News of Victory^70^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Nakansi^Overlord Or'barokh^Bring Down the Warbringer!^^^Return to Shadowmoon Village and speak with Overlord Or'barokh.^You must bring word of our success to Overlord Or'barokh immediately! Now that we've crushed the Legion and obliterated their presence in Shadowmoon Valley
column2: the overlord can turn his attention to our other foes. Although the Kor'kron guard will never admit it
column3: they'll be glad we're no longer fighting on two fronts.

column1: Whelps of the Wyrmcult^68^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Samia Inkling^Samia Inkling^Poaching from Poachers^^^Use the Blackwhelp Net to capture 10 Wyrmcult Blackwhelps.^I need to examine the whelps that they are raising at the Blackwing Coven. There should be an abundance of them flying around inside their cavernous base
column2: as well as a number of eggs
column3: which if you get close to them will likely hatch. Please
column4: <name>
column5: take the net and capture a handful of them alive for me. Find them by heading west across the Wyrmskull Bridge and heading through the Wyrmskull Tunnel. Follow the path to its end past Grishnath and the Raven's Wood.

column1: Maxnar Must Die!^68^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Tree Warden Chawn^Tree Warden Chawn^Wyrmskull Watcher^^^Slay Maxnar the Ashmaw.^They've left us no choice
column2: <name>. It's time to put an end to the threat from the Blackwing Coven by taking out their leader
column3: Maxnar the Ashmaw. I don't know if you caught a glimpse of him while you were in there
column4: but he's one of the dragonkin
column5: half-man
column6: half-dragon. And he's tough
column7: so don't underestimate him! Finish it quickly and with any luck you'll secure the safety of Evergrove and the Ruuan Weald.

column1: Baron Sablemane's Poison^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Baron Sablemane^Rexxar^Baron Sablemane's Poison^Into the Churning Gulch^Crush the Bloodmaul Camp^Deliver Baron Sablemane's Poison to Rexxar at Thunderlord Stronghold in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^Here
column2: take this to your master. I'm sure that whatever the reason
column3: Rexxar will put it to good use. Oh
column4: and do be certain to remind him that he owes me. He knows what I want
column5: and I'm certain that however he intends to obtain it for me
column6: I'll be seeing you again sooner than you think. Now
column7: do be a good little <boy /girl> and run this up to Rexxar.

column1: The Path of Conquest^70^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Overlord Or'barokh^Kor'kron Wind Rider^The Path of Conquest^^^Travel to the Path of Conquest in Shadowmoon Valley.^Word has come from my wind riders
column2: <name>. The Eclipsion blood elves are planning something big. They have begun forming their armies at the Path of Conquest
column3: far to the southeast - adjacent to Eclipse Point. I want you to travel to the Path of Conquest and assess the situation. Once you have done so
column4: use this flare gun to signal a wind rider. One will swoop down from the sky to meet you. Inform them of what you have discovered and they will give you your next set of orders.

column1: Breaching the Path^70^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Kor'kron Wind Rider^Kor'kron Wind Rider^The Path of Conquest^^^Slay 20 Eclipsion Soldiers
column2: 10 Eclipsion Cavaliers
column3: and 10 Eclipsion Spellbinders.^We're going to need more time
column4: <race>. I'm going to fly further ahead with some of the other wind riders. Hopefully
column5: we can gather some more information. What I need from you now is to clear a path and more importantly
column6: keep their arrows pointed away from us! Call for a wind rider with the Kor'kron flare gun once you have thinned their numbers.

column1: Onward to Ashenvale^20^Alliance^Ashenvale^Thundris Windweaver^Raene Wolfrunner^^^^Speak with Raene Wolfrunner in Astranaar.^Recently Raene Wolfrunner came through Auberdine from Darnassus and was heading to Ashenvale; she said something about the Furbolgs. I wasn't given an opportunity to ask more about her situation but perhaps you can seek her out and lend her your aid <class>. Take the southern road out of Auberdine. Once you reach Ashenvale border continue your path down the road. There you will find Astranaar and Raene Wolfrunner.
Culling the Wild^67^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Faradrella^Faradrella^^^^Slay 4 Felsworn Scalewing
column2: 4 Felsworn Daggermaw
column3: and 2 Fel Corrupters.^The number of atrocities committed by the Burning Legion is countless. Even as we speak
column4: they send their legion forces against the creatures of this land. Helpless to defend against their power
column5: they fall one by one. <name>
column6: help me stop these crimes of nature destroy all which they corrupt. Over the hill
column7: east of here
column8: you will see the corruption spreading across Bladed Gulch. Kill the ones causing the crime
column9: the Fel Corrupters
column10: and as many Felsworn as you can.

column1: Entry Into the Citadel^70^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Primed Key Mold^Force Commander Danath Trollbane^Entry Into the Citadel^^^Bring the Primed Key Mold to Force Commander Danath at Honor Hold in Hellfire Peninsula.^This freshly cast mold was to be used to create a key of some sort. From the image engraved on its back
column2: it appears to be related to Hellfire Citadel. Maybe this could prove to interest to Danath
column3: the force commander at Honor Hold.

column1: Entry Into the Citadel^70^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Primed Key Mold^Nazgrel^Entry Into the Citadel^^^Bring the Primed Key Mold to Nazgrel at Thrallmar in Hellfire Peninsula.^This freshly cast mold was to be used to create a key of some sort. From the image engraved on its back
column2: it appears to be related to Hellfire Citadel. Maybe this could prove to interest to Nazgrel
column3: the leader of the Horde's forces in Thrallmar.

column1: Grand Master Rohok^70^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Nazgrel^Rohok^Entry Into the Citadel^^^Bring the Primed Key Mold to Rohok at Thrallmar in Hellfire Peninsula.^The symbol on the key's handle... it is hard to make it out inside the mold
column2: but I recognize it as the Shattered Hand's own. There is a good chance this key will allow you to enter the Shattered Halls. Speak to Rohok
column3: our resident blacksmith. If anyone can forge this key it is he.

column1: Rohok's Request^70^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Rohok^Rohok^Entry Into the Citadel^^^Bring 4 Fel Iron Bars
column2: 2 Arcane Dust and 4 Motes of Fire to Rohok at Thrallmar in Hellfire Peninsula.^Fel orc blacksmiths may not be the most skilled in the world
column3: but there is some craftsmanship to their trade. Only fel iron can be used with this mold if we want to end up with a working key - anything else would probably end up breaking it. Bring me some fel iron bars
column4: a bit of arcane dust and motes of fire. I'll try my hand at it
column5: but I make no promises.

column1: Hotter than Hell^70^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Rohok^Rohok^Entry Into the Citadel^^^Destroy a Fel Reaver in Hellfire Peninsula and plunge the Unfired Key Mold into its remains. Bring the Charred Key Mold to Rohok in Thrallmar.^It's no good
column2: <name>! No matter how many coals I put to the fire
column3: it's just not enough heat. There's only one thing I can think of that is hot enough to temper this key and it is the insides of the Legion's fel reavers. I've only ever seen one downed once. I remember seeing its insides fuming
column4: shooting fire and steam as it fell. Take this mold and plunge it into a fallen fel reaver. I recommend you get yourself some friends if you plan to take one down.

column1: Find the Deserter^69^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Gryphonrider Kieran^Parshah^The Sketh'lon Wreckage^^Asghar's Totem^Locate Parshah in the Magma Fields and speak to him.^I get the feeling that all the pieces are here
column2: but I just can't put them together in a way that makes sense. I think our best lead is to attempt to locate this deserter. If he left his comrades at the camp
column3: there's a chance you might be able to persuade him to help us understand what the dark conclave arakkoa are planning. Start your search for him along the road in Magma Fields to the northwest. It seems a likely place for him to take refuge.

column1: The Sketh'lon Wreckage^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Sergeant Kargrul^Sergeant Kargrul^The Sketh'lon Wreckage^^^Recover the Skethlon Commander's Journal Page 1
column2: Skethlon Commander's Journal Page 2
column3: and Skethlon Commander's Journal Page 3 from the Dark Conclave arakkoa at the Sketh'lon Wreckage to Sergeant Kargrul at Shadowmoon Village.^The Sketh'lon Wreckage
column4: just to the east
column5: is an eerie place. The peons are convinced that it's cursed. There are few trees here
column6: so the peons have no choice but to venture into the arakkoa ruins to chop wood. The arakkoa spirits prey on the work groups
column7: draining their life and using it to fuel their foul magics. We must find out what is driving the dark conclave and stop them before their influence expands. Search the Sketh'lon Wreckage for evidence of their plans.

column1: Find the Deserter^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Sergeant Kargrul^Parshah^The Sketh'lon Wreckage^^Asghar's Totem^Locate Parshah in the Magma Fields and speak to him.^There's nothing here that would explain why the spirits of these arakkoa have remained in this world or how they came into thirst for the blood of orcs. I think our best lead is to try to find the deserter mentioned in the journal. If he left his comrades at the camp
column2: there's a chance you might be able to persuade him to help us understand what the dark conclave arakkoa are planning. Start your search for him on the road through the Magma Fields to the southeast.

column1: Grand Master Dumphry^70^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Force Commander Danath Trollbane^Dumphry^Entry Into the Citadel^^^Bring the Primed Key Mold to Dumphry in Honor Hold.^The symbol on the key's handle... it is hard to make it out inside the mold
column2: but I recognize it at the Shattered Hand's own. There is a good chance this key will allow you to enter the Shattered Halls. Speak to Dumphry. He is a master of his craft. If he can't craft this key for you
column3: no one can.

column1: Dumphry's Request^70^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Dumphry^Dumphry^Entry Into the Citadel^^^Bring 4 Fel Iron Bars
column2: 2 Arcane Dust and 4 Motes of Fire to Dumphry at Honor Hold in Hellfire Peninsula.^Fel orcs might be complete barbarians but their smithing is not as primitive as you might think. Only fel iron can be used with this mold if we want to end up with a working key - anything else would probably end up breaking it. Bring me some fel iron bars
column3: a bit of arcane dust and motes of fire. I'll try my hand at it
column4: but I make no promises.

column1: Hotter than Hell^70^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Dumphry^Dumphry^Entry Into the Citadel^^^Destroy a Fel Reaver in Hellfire Peninsula and plunge the Unfired Key Mold into its remains. Bring the Charred Key Mold to Dumphry in Honor Hold.^It's not working
column2: <lad /lass>. I cannot give it enough heat... the materials will not be properly tempered. You know
column3: the Fel Reavers used by the Burning Legion are powered by a scalding core of fel fire - it burns much hotter than normal fire. If you could find enough people to take one down
column4: you could heat the mold in the insides of the fallen reaver. Beware
column5: <class>
column6: those fel reavers pack quite a punch.

column1: When Worlds Collide...^70^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Kor'kron Wind Rider^Kor'kron Wind Rider^The Path of Conquest^^^Slay Chancellor Bloodleaf and Corok the Mighty and recover Illidan's Command.^At the southern end of the Path of Conquest
column2: near a stationary caravan
column3: I discovered what looked like a meeting between a giant and a blood elf chancellor. You've probably already noticed the smaller giants on the path as well. Something is just not right about all of this
column4: grunt. I want you to fight your way to this meeting and break up the party. Recover whatever you can from the scene and then call for one of us with the flare gun.

column1: Invasion Point: Cataclysm^69^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Wing Commander Nuainn^Plexi^Bring Down the Warbringer!^^^Report to Plexi at Invasion Point: Cataclysm.^Now that we have access to the Legion's base at Invasion Point: Cataclysm
column2: we need to figure out a way to shut down their operations there. Wildhammer Stronghold won't be safe until the Legion's presence is erased from Shadowmoon Valley. I've sent an advance party up to the invasion point to help you formulate a plan to destroy the Legion's supplies. Go back to Legion Hold and step into the teleporter with the green crystals above it. Plexi will meet you at your destination.

column1: Invasion Point: Cataclysm^69^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Blood Guard Gulmok^Nakansi^Bring Down the Warbringer!^^^Report to Nakansi at Invasion Point: Cataclysm.^Now that we have access to the Legion's base at Invasion Point: Cataclysm
column2: we need to figure out a way to shut down their operations there. Shadowmoon Village won't be safe until the Legion's presence is erased from the valley. I've sent an advance party up to the invasion point to help you formulate a plan to destroy the Legion's supplies. Go back to Legion Hold and step into the teleporter with the green crystals above it. Nakansi will meet you at your destination.

column1: Tabards of the Illidari^70^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Kor'kron Wind Rider^Kor'kron Wind Rider^The Path of Conquest^^^Collect 10 Illidari Tabards.^The wind riders must return to Shadowmoon Village to prepare for the next phase of our assault. What I need from you now are the tabards that these blood elves wear. When you have collected enough tabards
column2: call for a wind rider using the Kor'kron flare gun. Prepare yourself for a bit of espionage
column3: <race>!

column1: Dissension Amongst the Ranks...^70^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Kor'kron Wind Rider^Overlord Or'barokh^The Path of Conquest^^^Slay 5 Crazed Colossus while in disguise as an Illidari blood elf and return to Overlord Or'barokh at Shadowmoon Village in Shadowmoon Valley. He will also want his Kor'kron Flare Gun returned.^Researcher Tiorus was kind enough to put this concoction together for the final strike. I merely pour it upon this tabard that you have provided for me and the item is imbued with the essence of the Illidari filth. Take the enchanted tabard and travel to the Eclipsion Fields
column2: southwest of Eclipse Point. Once there
column3: use the tabard to transform into an agent of Illidan. While in disguise
column4: slay the crazed colossi that wander the field. They will think it an attack by the Eclipsion and sever all ties!

column1: Little Embers^67^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Mosswood the Ancient^Mosswood the Ancient^^^^Mosswood the Ancient wants you to kill 8 Scorch Imps and then return to him in Ruuan Weald.^Northeast of here
column2: on the plateau above us lies the burnt ashes of my ancient home. A great wood flourished there before the Burning Legion sent their imps to burn us away. So many died that even centuries later my tired old heart hungers for revenge. There are too many of them for us to ever reclaim the land
column3: but you could make them afraid. Surely you will help me?

column1: From the Ashes^67^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Mosswood the Ancient^Mosswood the Ancient^^^^Mosswood the Ancient wants you to journey to Skald and plant Ironroot Seeds in three different mounds of Fertile Volcanic Soil and then return to him in Ruuan Weald.^If you follow the road east and up the side of the mountain
column2: then turn north
column3: you will come to my long lost home. Once there was a wood there. Its name is forgotten. Long ago the Burning Legion summoned scorched imps and other creatures of flame. My home was destroyed and my people fled. Now only I remain. I have saved some ironroot seeds that could be planted in fertile volcanic soil. Their magic is strong. Do this for me and I will share with you the treasures of a forgotten age.

column1: The Path of Conquest^70^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Thane Yoregar^Wildhammer Gryphon Rider^The Path of Conquest^^^Travel to the Path of Conquest in Shadowmoon Valley.^My gryphon riders have come back with a bit of news! The Eclipsion blood elves are planning something big. They've begun forming their armies at the Path of Conquest
column2: located east of here - adjacent to Eclipse Point. I want you to travel to the Path of Conquest and assess the situation. Once you've done so
column3: use this flare gun to signal a gryphon rider. One will swoop down from the sky to meet you. Tell 'em what you've discovered and they'll give you the next set of orders.

column1: Breaching the Path^70^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Wildhammer Gryphon Rider^Wildhammer Gryphon Rider^The Path of Conquest^^^Slay 20 Eclipsion Soldiers
column2: 10 Eclipsion Cavaliers
column3: and 5 Sons of Corok.^We're going to need more time
column4: <race>. I'm going to fly further ahead with some of the other gryphon riders. Hopefully
column5: we can gather some more information. What I need from you now is to clear a path and more importantly
column6: keep their arrows pointed away from us! Call for a gryphon rider with the Wildhammer flare gun once you have thinned their numbers.

column1: Blood Elf + Giant = ???^70^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Wildhammer Gryphon Rider^Wildhammer Gryphon Rider^The Path of Conquest^^^Slay Chancellor Bloodleaf and Corok the Mighty and recover Illidan's Command.^At the southern end of the Path of Conquest
column2: near a stationary caravan
column3: I discovered what looked like a meeting between a giant and a blood elf chancellor. What are giants even doing here? Something is just not right about all of this
column4: grunt. I want you to fight your way to this meeting and break up the party. Recover whatever you can from the scene and then call for one of us with the flare gun.

column1: Tabards of the Illidari^70^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Wildhammer Gryphon Rider^Wildhammer Gryphon Rider^The Path of Conquest^^^Collect 10 Illidari Tabards.^The gryphon riders must return to Wildhammer Stronghold to prepare for the next phase of our assault. What I need from you now are the tabards that these blood elves wear. When you have collected enough tabards
column2: call for a gryphon rider using the Wildhammer flare gun. Prepare yourself for a bit of espionage
column3: <race>!

column1: Dissension Amongst the Ranks...^70^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Wildhammer Gryphon Rider^Thane Yoregar^The Path of Conquest^^^Slay 5 Crazed Colossus while in disguise as an agent of Illidan and return to Thane Yoregar at Wildhammer Stronghold in Shadowmoon Valley. He will also want his Wildhammer Flare Gun returned.^Gnomus was kind enough to put this concoction together for the final strike. I merely pour it upon this tabard that you have provided for me and the item is imbued with the essence of the Illidari filth. Take the enchanted tabard and travel to the Eclipsion Fields
column2: southwest of Eclipse Point. Once there
column3: use the tabard to transform into an agent of Illidan. While in disguise
column4: slay the crazed colossi that wander the field. They will think it an attack by the Eclipsion and sever all ties!

column1: Asghar's Totem^69^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Parshah^Parshah^The Sketh'lon Wreckage^^^Bring the Sketh'lon War Totem to Parshah in the Magma Fields.^What you read in the commander's journal is true. While the orcish Horde massed under Gul'dan
column2: my people sought to defend ourselves from the threat by striking against him. Gul'dan learned of their intentions and cast a mighty spell that destroyed our camps and twisted the spirits of my brothers. They must be stopped before they unleash a greater evil. In the Sketh'lon Wreckage to the north
column3: seek out Asghar and bring me the totem he carries. With it
column4: we can begin to thwart the dark conclave's plans.

column1: The Rod of Lianthe^69^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Parshah^Parshah^The Sketh'lon Wreckage^^^Obtain Lianthe's Key from any of the blood elves at Eclipse Point and use it to open Lianthe's Strongbox and claim the Rod of Lianthe. Return the rod to Parshah in the Magma Fields.^The totem alone is not strong enough to counteract the sinister magics of the dark conclave. We can combine it with other objects of power
column2: forming a staff to focus the energies. We cannot rescue my brethren from the depths of their depravity
column3: but we can stop them. One of the items I need for the staff is the Rod of Lianthe
column4: held by the blood elves at Eclipse Point to the southeast. It is kept in a pavilion on the top tier of the ruins and will be heavily guarded. Use caution
column5: <name>.

column1: Sketh'lon Feathers^69^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Parshah^Parshah^The Sketh'lon Wreckage^^^Gather 8 Sketh'lon Feathers and bring them to Parshah in the Magma Fields.^There is one last element missing from the staff. We must direct the staff's power toward the Dark Conclave spirits. We can do that by gathering feathers scattered on the ground at the Sketh'lon Base Camp and using them in the staff. The base camp is to the south
column2: east of Wildhammer Stronghold. Gul'dan's magic utterly destroyed my brethren
column3: leaving only their spirits
column4: but it did not stop there. The magic fed on the spell the arakkoa were preparing
column5: forging a sinister force that engulfed the spirits.

column1: Battle of the Crimson Watch^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Crystal Prison^A'dal^The Journal of Val'zareq: Portends of Wa^^^Battle the forces of Illidan at Crimson Watch and survive!^They are probably searching for you on the Path of Conquest as we speak. You must make your escape
column2: <race>! Leave me
column3: I'm done for... They... I think I hear them coming. It's now or never! Get out! If you choose to stay
column4: you will have to fight! If you fight and somehow manage to survive
column5: take what you have learned here and deliver that knowledge to A'dal in Shattrath City.

column1: Imbuing the Headpiece^69^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Parshah^Parshah^The Sketh'lon Wreckage^^^Equip the Unfinished Headpiece
column2: travel to the Altar of Damnation
column3: and use it while standing near Gul'dan. When the headpiece is energized
column4: return to Parshah in the Magma Fields.^The staff is nearly finished! All that remains is to imbue the headpiece with power flowing from the echoes of Gul'dan in this accursed place. To the east
column5: near the Fel Pits and south of the Deathforge
column6: is the Altar of Damnation. There
column7: fragments of Gul'dan's past are trapped. When you carry the unfinished headpiece of the staff into the area around the altar
column8: don't be surprised if some of the entities react to it. You will be carrying a dangerous object with strong connections to the cataclysm.

column1: Baron Sablemane^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Rexxar^Baron Sablemane^The Spirits Have Voices^^^Speak with Baron Sablemane at the Circle of Blood in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^Here is my plan. We will poison the ogres and then destroy their gronn master. During my travels in these mountains
column2: I met a man named Baron Sablemane. He is a master of the alchemical arts
column3: and may be convinced to assist us. You will find him at the Circle of Blood
column4: down in the canyon to the north of here. Whatever price he requires
column5: I will leave it to your discretion to accept.

column1: Crush the Bloodmaul Camp^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Tor'chunk Twoclaws^Tor'chunk Twoclaws^^Baron Sablemane's Poison^^Slay 10 Bloodmaul Maulers and 5 Bloodmaul Warlocks.^<Tor'chunk leans in close to whisper.> <name>
column2: you've done us more than proud in the fight against the ogres so far. And while I have every confidence in what Rexxar has planned
column3: I would still ask that you crush the ogres at Bloodmaul Camp before returning. That way we'll be doubly certain of the outcome. To get there
column4: head north down the ramp out of Thunderlord. Then
column5: at the base of the ramp
column6: head west across Dragons' End and north through the Churning Gulch and Daggermaw Canyon.

column1: It's a Trap!^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Baron Sablemane^Rexxar^Baron Sablemane's Poison^^Slaughter at Boulder'mok^Deliver the Dragonfire Trap to Rexxar at Thunderlord Stronghold in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^There's is no cause of fury greater in this world than that of Gruul and his sons. They slaughtered my people - my children - and now I will have revenge. I have fashioned a trap from dragon fire
column2: and if you're clever enough
column3: you can use it to kill even a gronn. Just hurry
column4: take the trap to Rexxar. My thirst for revenge must be quenched.

column1: Slaughter at Boulder'mok^68^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Tor'chunk Twoclaws^Tor'chunk Twoclaws^^It's a Trap!^^Slay 5 Boulder'mok Brutes and 3 Boulder'mok Shaman
column2: and then return to Tor'chunk Twoclaws at Thunderlord Stronghold in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^I know that Rexxar has plans for you to head to Boulder'mok. I have something that I want you to do while you are there. We must take any chance we can get to strike down the ogres of these mountains
column3: or they will overrun us
column4: and all that we have bled and died for will be for nothing! Boulder'mok lies far to the northwest. Travel north to Ruuan Weald
column5: and from there head west through the tunnel and past the Raven's Wood. <name>
column6: I want you to kill the Bladespire ogres of Boulder'mok. Wipe them out!

column1: Return to Talionia^10^Blood Elf^Warlock^Carendin Halgar^Talionia^Return to Talionia^^^Speak with Talionia in Silvermoon City.^One of your masters
column2: Talionia
column3: in Silvermoon City has sent a summons for you
column4: <name>. I'm certain it is time you learned to summon and control a more powerful demon
column5: so I suggest you see her at once. I understand Talionia is found in The Sanctum
column6: a cozy little den of evil found along Murder Row.

column1: Return to Carendin Halgar^10^Undead^Warlock^Gan'rul Bloodeye^Carendin Halgar^Return to Carendin Halgar^^^Speak with Carendin Halgar in Undercity.^Ah
column2: so there you are
column3: <name>. Carendin Halgar has sent out word for you to come see him in the Magic Quarter of Undercity. He is not known for his patience
column4: so I would not wait long.

column1: Return to Gan'rul Bloodeye^10^Orc^Warlock^Carendin Halgar^Gan'rul Bloodeye^Return to Gan'rul Bloodeye^^^Speak with Gan'rul Bloodeye in Orgrimmar.^You are a long way from home
column2: <race>. Perhaps it is time you returned to learn from your master
column3: Gan'rul Bloodeye. His knowledge is known to all of our craft
column4: even those of us here. Gan'rul dwells in the Cleft of Shadow in Orgrimmar.

column1: Welcoming the Wolf Spirit^64^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Malukaz^Malukaz^Vestments of the Wolf Spirit^^^Use the Ceremonial Incense near the candles in Malukaz's hut and observe the ceremony. When the ceremony is complete
column2: speak with Malukaz again.^I've nearly completed the vestments that I'll wear during the ceremony. As I add the finishing touches
column3: I'd like you to set this incense by the candles near the runestone to my left. I believe it will help us to attract the wolf spirit's attention
column4: since it was made in the days of the orcish clans. I can almost imagine my ancestors using it in a ceremony paying tribute to the wolf spirit after a successful hunt. Once you've placed the incense
column5: I'll begin the ceremony.

column1: Zeth'Gor Must Burn!^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Captain Darkhowl^Captain Darkhowl^^Wanted: Worg Master Kruush^^Kill Bleeding Hollow Peons for their torches
column2: ignite them at Zeth'Gor's forge then throw the burning torches at Zeth'Gor Buildings.^The Bleeding Hollow clan have betrayed their noble heritage! We
column3: the orcs who fought and died to save ourselves from the fel taint of Mannoroth
column4: look upon our vile cousins and see only weakness and ignobility... and for that
column5: they must burn! Enter Zeth'Gor
column6: their bastion to the east
column7: and burn their buildings. Kill peons for their torches
column8: ignite them at their forge
column9: and hurl the burning torches at their hovels
column10: their stable and their barracks. Burn them all
column11: and then return to me! For the Horde!

column1: The Journal of Val'zareq: Portends of War^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^The Journal of Val'zareq^Crystal Prison^The Journal of Val'zareq: Portends of War^^^Locate Marcus Auralion
column2: High General of the Sha'tar
column3: at Crimson Watch.^This journal documents the recent activities of Illidan's armies. It also explains why Val'zareq was parading around the Path of Conquest. He was personally responsible for the capture of a high general of the Sha'tar. This general is being held at a post known as Crimson Watch
column4: located at the southern end of the Path of Conquest. A mysterious faction
column5: calling itself the Crimson Sigil
column6: is charged with his incarceration. If you choose to investigate
column7: it would be wise to bring allies.

column1: Rogues of the Shattered Hand^24^Horde^Rogue^Zelanis^Shenthul^Rogues of the Shattered Hand^^^Speak with Shenthul in Orgrimmar.^<name>
column2: there are secrets in the world that we do not yet possess. The Shattered Hand in Orgrimmar can lead you to one of these secrets: the method for brewing deadly poisons. Do as they ask and you will gain their trust. To reach Orgrimmar
column3: take the portal in Silvermoon City to Undercity. Then
column4: travel outside the city and find the nearby tower where the goblin Zepplins pick up their passengers. From there
column5: fly to the city of Orgrimmar where you can find Shenthul in the Cleft of Shadow.

column1: A Date with Dorgok^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Commander Haephus Stonewall^Commander Haephus Stonewall^^^Favor of the Gronn^Slay Dorgok at Bloodmaul Camp.^Good
column2: I've seen you around and I've been meaning to speak to you about a matter of some importance. There are reports coming in that for some reason the Bloodmaul ogres are planning an offensive against Sylvanaar and Ruuan Weald. We don't know who or what is pushing them to do this
column3: but I intend to nip their plan in the bud! Bloodmaul Camp is where the attacks are to be staged from. Head northwest down the ramp out of the Ruuan Weald and you will find it. I want you to kill their leader
column4: Dorgok!

column1: Crush the Bloodmaul Camp!^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Lieutenant Fairweather^Lieutenant Fairweather^^^^Slay 10 Bloodmaul Maulers and 5 Bloodmaul Warlocks.^I've heard that you've done us more than proud in the fight against the ogres thus far. Now
column2: I would ask that you face them again. I want you to crush the ogres at Bloodmaul Camp! To get down there
column3: head northwest down the ramp out of the Ruuan Weald. You'll find them at the base of the ramp. Good luck
column4: <class>!

column1: Favor of the Gronn^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Gorgrom's Favor^Commander Haephus Stonewall^Favor of the Gronn^A Date with Dorgok^^Deliver Gorgrom's Favor to Commander Haephus Stonewall at Evergrove in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^A token in the form of a small statuette falls from Dorgok's dead clutch. It bears a striking resemblance to one of the gronn. Surely
column2: Commander Haephus Stonewall at Evergrove in the Ruuan Weald
column3: up the ramp to the east
column4: would be interested in this!

column1: Pay the Baron a Visit^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Commander Haephus Stonewall^Baron Sablemane^Favor of the Gronn^^^Speak with Baron Sablemane at the Circle of Blood in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^This is bad news. Gorgrom the Dragon-Eater is behind the recent Bloodmaul plans against Sylvanaar! Why he's manipulating them
column2: and not just using the Bladespire
column3: I don't know. But if we're to deal with a gronn
column4: we're going to need help. I know a man who is wise in the ways of all sorts of exotic magics. Baron Sablemane is his name
column5: and you can find him at the Circle of Blood
column6: back down the ramp to the northwest
column7: and then southwest through the canyon. Ask him to fashion us a trap for the gronn.

column1: Into the Churning Gulch^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Baron Sablemane^Baron Sablemane^Favor of the Gronn^^^Collect 7 Crust Burster Venom Glands.^Very well
column2: I'll create this trap
column3: but first I want something in return. There happens to be a nearby gronn that is in possession of an item that I want
column4: but you can't face him
column5: not yet anyway. So
column6: you and I are going to fashion a sleeping powder from the poison of the nearby crust bursters. You'll find them in the Churning Gulch to the southwest. Bring me a number of their glands
column7: and be quick about it!

column1: Goodnight
column2: Gronn^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Baron Sablemane^Baron Sablemane^Favor of the Gronn^^^Collect Grulloc's Sack.^I've outdone myself again. I've fashioned a sleeping powder for you to use on Grulloc
column3: the gronn I spoke of who is guarding what I want. Grulloc keeps himself at the Cursed Hollow
column4: an area at the eastern edge of Dragons' End on the other side of the Circle of Blood. If I were you
column5: I wouldn't tarry long once you have his sack. The effects of the dust won't last long.

column1: It's a Trap!^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Baron Sablemane^Commander Haephus Stonewall^Favor of the Gronn^^Slaughter at Boulder'mok^Deliver the Dragonfire Trap to Commander Haephus Stonewall at Evergrove in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^There's nothing more that I hate in this world than the sons of Gruul and their father! They slaughtered my people
column2: and my children
column3: and now I will have a taste of revenge! I have fashioned a trap from some dragon fire
column4: and if you're clever enough
column5: you might just be able to use it to kill a gronn. I'm sure that you have a particular gronn in mind; it matters not to me which one you kill. Just hurry
column6: take the trap to your Commander Stonewall. My thirst for revenge must be quenched!

column1: Gorgrom the Dragon-Eater^68^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Commander Haephus Stonewall^Commander Haephus Stonewall^Favor of the Gronn^^^Collect 3 Grisly Totems from Boulder'mok ogres. Then
column2: use Sablemane's Trap at Gorgrom's Altar to summon and kill Gorgrom the Dragon-Eater.^We must show the ogres that we are not to be trifled with. We must send a message. Travel to Boulder'mok and kill the ogres there. Make sure you keep their heads. Then go to Gorgrom's altar and place the trap there for him. Gorgrom will appear
column3: and you must lure him into the trap. When he is dead
column4: mount your grisly totems near his corpse
column5: so that the ogres may look at their fallen master and their fallen brothers
column6: and know the price for seeking to destroy us.

column1: Slaughter at Boulder'mok^68^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Lieutenant Fairweather^Lieutenant Fairweather^^It's a Trap!^^Slaughter 5 Boulder'mok Brutes and 3 Boulder'mok Shaman.^I know that we have plans for you to head to Boulder'mok. I have something that I want you to do while you are there. We must take any chance we can get to strike down the ogres of these mountains
column2: or they will overrun us
column3: and all that we have bled and died for will be for nothing! Boulder'mok lies to the west. Travel southwest
column4: cross the bridge and head through the tunnel. On the west side of the Raven's Wood you will find them. <name>
column5: I want you to wipe out the Bladespire ogres of Boulder'mok.

column1: Kindness^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Mordenai^Mordenai^Kindness^^^Mordenai at Netherwing Fields in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to feed 8 Mature Netherwing Drakes.^Something has them spooked
column2: <race>. <Mordenai points to the nether drakes flying overhead.> They won't even come down to feed. I have seen several fall to the earth
column3: dead from exhaustion before their bodies hit the ground. We must save them! The Rocknail flayers that are found near the crystals are their natural prey. Kill flayers and take their carcasses. Place a carcass in the field and stand extremely still. As long as you do not make any aggressive motions
column4: they will not attack you.

column1: Massacre at Gruul's Lair^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Baron Sablemane^Baron Sablemane^Favor of the Gronn^^^Slay 10 Bladespire Enforcers
column2: 5 Bladespire Battlemages
column3: 5 Bladespire Ravagers and their leader
column4: Fingrom.^You've proven yourself resourceful
column5: and now I think I'm going to put you to personal use in my own fight against Gruul and his sons. The Bladespire clan are the favored of the gronn
column6: and while you may have thinned out their numbers elsewhere
column7: you haven't yet dealt with their strongest. Gruul protects the exterior of his lair with only the toughest of ogres
column8: and it is those that you must kill. Head north through the Daggermaw Canyon and you will find Gruul's Lair at the end.

column1: Showdown^70^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Baron Sablemane^Baron Sablemane^Favor of the Gronn^^^Use Sablemane's Signet at the Altar of Goc
column2: then kill Goc.^The time has come for us to face Goc
column3: the master of the Bladespire ogres. It is also time that I take a hand in events
column4: to see the last of the gronn's life. Take my signet ring. When you come to the Altar of Goc
column5: use it
column6: and I will come to join you. Together we will destroy Goc.

column1: The Ashtongue Broken^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Varen the Reclaimer^Varen the Reclaimer^The Ashtongue Broken^^Reclaiming Holy Grounds^Varen the Reclaimer wants you to go to the Ruins of Baa'ri and slay 3 Ashtongue Handlers
column2: 4 Ashtongue Warriors and 6 Ashtongue Shaman.^The Ashtongue tribe is feared among all Broken. It consists of the most vicious and bloodthirsty individuals
column3: handpicked by Akama himself. They are as fierce and ruthless as any naga
column4: demon or blood elf in Illidan's army and they have been deployed in large numbers at the Ruins of Baa'ri
column5: to the north. Go there and put a dent in their numbers before they get a chance to mount an attack on us.

column1: Thwart the Dark Conclave^69^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Parshah^Parshah^The Sketh'lon Wreckage^^^Slay the Dark Conclave Ritualists and use the Staff of Parshah to end the Dark Conclave's summoning ritual
column2: then return to Parshah in the Magma Fields.^The spirits of the dark conclave seek to summon an ancient and powerful evil through a ritual conducted at the lava pits to the south of the Sketh'lon Base Camp. Gul'dan's magic mingled with their own
column3: empowering them to aid this creature in manifesting in our world! We must not allow this to happen
column4: <name>. The death and destruction it would bring are unimaginable! Carry the staff with you to the site of the summoning and use its magics to stop the dark conclave once and for all!

column1: Wanted: Worg Master Kruush^60^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Wanted Poster^Captain Darkhowl^^^Zeth'Gor Must Burn!
column2: The Eyes of Grillok^Kill Worg Master Kruush and bring his head to Captain Darkhowl in Spinebreaker Post.^The poster reads: "Worg Master Kruush leads the worg riders of the Bleeding Hollow clan. A price has been placed on his head
column3: for his riders exact heavy tolls on supply trains to Spinebreaker Post." "Scouts report him within Zeth'Gor
column4: and the hero able to bring the severed head of this villain to me will earn the thanks of the Horde
column5: and a large bounty." "-Captain Darkhowl"

column1: Damaged Mask^68^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Damaged Mask^O'Mally Zapnabber^Damaged Mask^^^Deliver the Damaged Mask to O'Mally Zapnabber at Evergrove in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^As you examine the damaged mask
column2: you hear strange sounds coming from within. If the mask wasn't damaged you might be able to hear the sounds more clearly. O'Mally Zapnabber in Ruuan Weald might be able to fix the mask.

column1: Seek Out Neltharaku^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Mordenai^Neltharaku^Kindness^^^Seek out Neltharaku
column2: patron of the Netherwing Dragonflight.^Their patron soars high above
column3: <name>. Perhaps the kindness that you showed his children has moved his heart. Seek Neltharaku out and enlist his aid. Together
column4: you may be able to solve the plight of the Netherwing drakes. <Mordenai points to the sky.> Fly high
column5: friend...

column1: Mystery Mask^68^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^O'Mally Zapnabber^Wildlord Antelarion^Damaged Mask^^^Deliver the Mystery Mask to Wildlord Antelarion at Evergrove in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^Ok
column2: it should work now. What is it
column3: you ask? Why
column4: it's a communication device - it allows those blockheads to communicate with each other. You know
column5: the Burning Legion! I would suggest that you hand this mask to Wildlord Antelarion. He's over there pacing around. Always moving
column6: he is. Well get moving
column7: he's been trying to get his hands on one of these for sometime now.

column1: The Eyes of Grillok^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Zezzak^Zezzak^The Eyes of Grillok^Wanted: Worg Master Kruush^^Use Zezzak's Shard to capture an Eye of Grillok
column2: then approach Zezzak's cauldron to extract it. After it is removed
column3: return Zezzak's Shard to him.^<name>
column4: you have braved the lair of the Bleeding Hollow orcs
column5: dreaded Zeth'Gor
column6: and survived! Perhaps you have the strength to aid me
column7: for I aim to gaze into the mind of its darkest witch
column8: Grillok! Take this shard. Use it to ensorcel an Eye of Grillok and bind it to yourself. Return here and approach my cauldron... and it will pull the eye from you. Go
column9: <name>. And use care -- An Eye of Grillok will betray you to our enemies if given the slightest opening!

column1: Neltharaku's Tale^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Neltharaku^Neltharaku^Kindness^^^Speak with Neltharaku and listen to his story.^I have information that you may find useful. Please listen to what I have to tell you
column2: <race>.

column1: Reclaiming Holy Grounds^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Vindicator Aluumen^Vindicator Aluumen^The Ashtongue Tribe^^^Vindicator Aluumen wants you to slay 8 Shadowmoon Slayers
column2: 8 Shadowmoon Chosen and 4 Shadowmoon Darkweavers.^You did well against the Broken in Baa'ri
column3: <name>. Let's see how well you do against Illidan's most feared army. The fel orcs of the Shadowmoon Clan occupy the Ata'mal Terrace
column4: once a very holy site where ata'mal crystals were used in spiritual ceremonies. We had reason to believe they were hiding an actual ata'mal crystal in the vicinity
column5: but our scrying has revealed nothing. Nevertheless
column6: the fel orcs are on draenei holy ground and their presence must be dealt with.

column1: The Great Retribution^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Varen the Reclaimer^Varen the Reclaimer^The Ashtongue Broken^^^Varen the Reclaimer wants you to slay 8 Shadowmoon Slayers
column2: 8 Shadowmoon Chosen and 4 Shadowmoon Darkweavers.^You did well against the Ashtongue Broken
column3: <name>. I have another challenge for you
column4: should you be up to it. Not too long ago
column5: the Sanctum of the Stars suffered a tremendous attack by Illidan's fel orcs. We've determined it was perpetrated by the Shadowmoon orcs who occupy the Ata'mal Terrace. Show them that the Scryers are not to be trifled with.

column1: Baron Sablemane Has Requested Your Presence^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Commander Haephus Stonewall^Baron Sablemane^Favor of the Gronn^^^Speak with Baron Sablemane at the Circle of Blood in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^<name>
column2: while you were out being one hell of a <class>
column3: Baron Sablemane sent his pet dragon up here with a message. He's asked for you personally. From what I understand
column4: he wants you to head up his own fight against the gronn. I guess you're the most qualified person in all of Outland to help him
column5: but if I were you
column6: I'd get in contact with a couple of friends first and ask them to join you at the Circle of Blood.

column1: Felsworn Gas Mask^68^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Wildlord Antelarion^Legion Communicator^Damaged Mask^^^Wear the Felsworn Gas Mask and use the Legion Communicator at Forge Camp: Anger in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^I have a very special mission for you
column2: <name>. I need you to infiltrate Forge Camp: Anger east of here. When you enter the camp you will need to wear the Felsworn gas mask and locate the Legion communicator. Once you have located the communication device speak with whomever is on the other side of the device. If all works out you can trick the demon into something devious! Try telling the demon that Camp Anger has revolted. Good luck to you <class>.

column1: Deceive thy Enemy^68^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Legion Communicator^Legion Communicator^Damaged Mask^^^Slay 4 Doomforge Attendants and 4 Doomforge Engineers.^For every moment I hear silence
column2: you draw closer to your death! SPEAK! What? The camp has revolted? This cannot possibly be true! My minions would not dare undermine my authority. Well then
column3: every last one of them will pay for this treachery
column4: they will pay dearly. Silence them all and be done with it! Report back to me once you have carried out my order or you shall be dealt with.

column1: You're Fired!^68^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Legion Communicator^Wildlord Antelarion^Damaged Mask^^^Slay Doomcryer.^Doomcryer did nothing to stop the revolt? How dare she! She has been trying to undermine my authority for some time. However
column2: this time will be her last. You must summon her and deal with her personally. Her anger guards hold the keys that summon her to Forge Camp: Anger. Retrieve the five keys and activate the five Legion obelisks. The obelisks have a short duration
column3: so make sure they are all activated at the same time. Remember
column4: the anger guards carry more keys.

column1: Sunfury Signets^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Battlemage Vyara^Battlemage Vyara^^^Single Sunfury Signet
column2: More Sunfury Signets^Battlemage Vyara at the Sanctum of the Stars wants you to bring her 10 Sunfury Signets.^The survival of the Scryers hinges on outrecruiting Kael'thas. Every pilgrim from Quel'Thalas that joins his side brings him closer to victory. The opposite is true for us. Soon
column3: however
column4: we will run out of recruits and it will come down to what side can kill the other quicker. Prove your worth to the Scryers by bringing me Sunfury signets worn by high-ranking blood elves allied with Kael'thas and Illidan. You'll find them at Eclipse Point to the west and the Ruins of Karabor
column5: to the northeast.

column1: The Truth Unorbed^68^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Orb of the Grishna^Tree Warden Chawn^^^Treebole Must Know^Deliver the Orb of the Grishna to Tree Warden Chawn at Evergrove in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^This strange
column2: magical orb drops from beneath the contour feathers of the arakkoa. Suffused with an eerie
column3: purple glow
column4: the orb pulses to an unheard beat. Holding it makes you mildly uncomfortable
column5: and so you quickly place it within your pack. Perhaps Tree Warden Chawn at Ruuan Weald to the west
column6: through the tunnel and across the Wyrmskull Bridge
column7: would be interested in examining it?

column1: Marks of Sargeras^70^All^Shattrath City^Harbinger Saronen^Harbinger Saronen^^^More Marks of Sargeras
column2: Single Mark of Sargeras^Bring 10 Marks of Sargeras to Harbinger Saronen in Shadowmoon Valley.^By now it should be clear to you why we oppose the Burning Legion and those who serve them. If you wish to prove yourself to the Aldor
column3: bring me the insignias of high-ranking Legion and their Shadow Council followers. Here in Shadowmoon you will find a strong Legion presence to the far west in Legion Hold and the Deathforge.

column1: Treebole Must Know^68^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Tree Warden Chawn^Treebole^Treebole Must Know^The Truth Unorbed^^Speak with Treebole
column2: an ancient of lore who lives in the Raven's Wood of the Blade's Edge Mountains.^This is troubling! The arakkoa are causing the ancients and protectors to become possessed by evil spirits! But
column3: there is one ancient that could not possibly have been affected. His name is Treebole
column4: and you must go to him at once if we're to save the trees of the Raven's Wood! Go back to the Raven's Wood. You will find him at the fork in the path just past Grishnath.

column1: Exorcising the Trees^68^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Treebole^Treebole^Treebole Must Know^^^Collect 5 Grishnath Orbs and 5 Dire Pinfeathers and then combine them into Exorcism Feathers. Use these feathers to exorcise and slay 5 Koi-Koi Spirits from the Raven's Wood Leafbeards.^The Grishna have caused the leafbeards and stonebarks to be inhabited by evil koi-koi spirits. We must save the trees or soon all of the Raven's Wood will be lost forever! Combine the magic of a Grishnath orb
column2: found throughout Grishnath
column3: with a dire pinfeather from a dire raven. Use the resultant exorcism feather to draw out and slay the koi-koi spirit as quickly as possible. The stonebarks are too powerful for this ritual
column4: but if enough leafbeards are saved
column5: they will be freed as well.

column1: Becoming a Mooncloth Tailor^70^All^Tailoring^Nasmara Moonsong^Nasmara Moonsong^^^^Use the Square of Imbued Netherweave while standing in Cenarion Refuge's moonwell to create a Sample of Primal Mooncloth. Bring the completed sample back to Nasmara Moonsong in Shattrath's Lower City.^I can teach you the ways of mooncloth tailoring
column2: if you are interested.. By specializing in mooncloth tailoring
column3: creating primal mooncloth will yield twice the normal amount and you will have access to several exclusive patterns. All that is required is that you pass a simple test. As to the test
column4: your task is to create a small sample of primal mooncloth in the moonwell at Cenarion Refuge. I will provide all the materials you'll need. When you've created the sample
column5: bring it back to me for examination.

column1: Becoming a Spellfire Tailor^70^All^Tailoring^Gidge Spellweaver^Gidge Spellweaver^^^^Bring a sample of Nether-wraith Essence to Gidge Spellweaver in Shattrath's Lower City.^I can teach you the ways of spellfire tailoring if you wish
column2: but be warned
column3: it's a dangerous pursuit. Creating spellcloth in Netherstorm attracts powerful nether-wraiths. I'm searching for a way to lessen backlash
column4: but I need more nether-wraith essence for my research. Take this beacon with you to Netherstorm and use it to summon a nether-wraith. Bring back its essence and I'll agree to teach you. As a spellfire tailor
column5: you'll receive twice as much cloth and have access to exclusive patterns.

column1: Becoming a Shadoweave Tailor^70^All^Tailoring^Andrion Darkspinner^Andrion Darkspinner^^^^Use the Crystal of Deep Shadows near the Altar of Shadows to deepen your attunement to the altar
column2: then return to Andrion Darkspinner in Shattrath's Lower City.^If you become a shadoweave specialist
column3: you will make twice as much shadowcloth as an average tailor and have access to several exclusive patterns. Of course
column4: any tailor can use the Altar of Shadows
column5: but a shadoweave tailor possesses a deeper attunement to the altar
column6: unlocking powers that few can fathom. Take this crystal to eastern Shadowmoon Valley
column7: and find Netherwing Pass leading south from the Netherwing Fields. Near the world's edge
column8: you will find the Altar of Shadows. Use the crystal there.

column1: Grillok "Darkeye"^62^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Zezzak^Zezzak^The Eyes of Grillok^^^Kill Grillok Darkeye and bring Grillok's Eyepatch to Zezzak in Spinebreaker Post.^Grillok Darkeye has wagered a piece of himself to dark powers
column2: and gained great magic for it. His lost eye burns deep in some hellish pit
column3: now a demon's trinket... and the patch that covers his betrayal holds its own dark secrets. Bring me Grillok's eyepatch
column4: <name>
column5: and I will reward you greatly for your service...

column1: Apothecary Antonivich^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Apothecary Albreck^Apothecary Antonivich^Boiling Blood^^^Bring Albreck's Findings to Apothecary Antonivich at Thrallmar in Hellfire Peninsula.^<name>
column2: I have prepared a preliminary report of my findings regarding the Bleeding Hollow orcs. My colleague in Thrallmar
column3: Apothecary Antonivich
column4: will be happy to receive them. He too studies the phenomenon of fel orcs... in hopes of preventing such a tragedy from again befalling our orcish allies. Take him this report
column5: and I will continue my study of the blood you brought me. If fortune is with us
column6: we will isolate the cause of the fel orc affliction.

column1: Infiltrating Dragonmaw Fortress^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Neltharaku^Neltharaku^Kindness^^^Neltharaku
column2: flying high above Netherwing Fields in Shadowmoon Valley
column3: wants you to slay 15 Dragonmaw Orcs.^I require time so that I may devise a plan to save my children and mate. You will buy me this time
column4: mortal. Venture into Dragonmaw Fortress
column5: located on the eastern edge of the Netherwing Fields
column6: and lay waste to all Dragonmaw orcs that you find. The ensuing chaos and confusion should have a considerable impact on their plans. Be warned
column7: some of my kin are too far gone - their minds corrupted by the Dragonmaw. For them
column8: the only resolution is death. You have my permission to end their lives as well.

column1: To Netherwing Ledge!^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Neltharaku^Neltharaku^Kindness^^^Neltharaku
column2: flying high above Netherwing Fields in Shadowmoon Valley
column3: wants you to collect 12 Nethervine Crystals from Netherwing Ledge.^I believe that I can imbue nethervine crystals with my own essence. The power contained within these imbued crystals should be sufficient to free enslaved drakes of their masters' grasps. Travel to Netherwing Ledge
column4: an island located off the broken shelf of Shadowmoon Valley
column5: to the southeast. It is on Netherwing Ledge that you will find nethervine crystals. Return to me when you have collected enough crystals to fill your packs. And <name>
column6: Beware the Dragonmaw that now inhabit the island.

column1: The Demoniac Scryer^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Apothecary Antonivich^Apothecary Antonivich^Boiling Blood^^^Use the Demoniac Scryer in Hellfire Basin
column2: wait for it to attune
column3: and then take a reading.^The Demoniac Scryer is now ready. Take it behind Hellfire Citadel
column4: to Hellfire Basin
column5: and summon it upon the ground. It will then begin to attune itself to Hellfire Citadel. After its attunement
column6: speak to the Scryer and transcribe what it tells you. Bring that transcription to me... Go
column7: <name>
column8: but only when you are ready. There is no doubt that Hellfire Citadel will detect the Scryer and send wardens to destroy it!

column1: Veil Skith: Darkstone of Terokk^64^All^Terokkar Forest^Kirrik the Awakened^Kirrik the Awakened^Surrender to the Horde^^^Use the Rod of Purification on the Darkstone of Terokk in Veil Skith and return to Kirrik the Awakened at the Refugee Caravan in the Bone Wastes.^Veil Skith lies to the northwest of the caravan and to the south of Shattrath in a secluded grove of the forest. It is rumored that the colony of Skettis has constructed a maligned altar of worship. This Darkstone of Terokk must be purified if the arakkoa of Skith are ever to be redeemed. Take this Rod of Purification and cast it upon the Darkstone. Blessed by A'dal
column2: the rod's purity might be enough to bring clarity to the Darkstone. Go now and may the light shine upon thee.

column1: The Tomb of Lights^65^All^Terokkar Forest^High Priest Orglum^High Priest Orglum^^Seek Out Kirrik^Recover the Bones^High Priest Orglum wants you to journey to the Tomb of Lights and kill 10 Ethereal Nethermancers and 10 Ethereal Plunderers and then return to him at the Refugee Caravan.^To the east
column2: buried under the charred sand
column3: is the Tomb of Lights
column4: a lost resting place of the dead. Before our caravan was ambushed I was going to journey to the tomb and cleanse it of evil spirits. Little did I know it was already infested with another kind of evil. Even now the ethereals plunder the bodies of the fallen for trinkets and keepsakes that were given to the dead centuries ago. There is little I can do while our caravan struggles to survive.

column1: Vengeful Souls^65^All^Terokkar Forest^High Priest Orglum^High Priest Orglum^^Seek Out Kirrik^^High Priest Orglum wants you to journey into the Tomb of Lights and defeat 5 Vengeful Draenei.^The Tomb of Lights has become corrupted by the Shadow Council and the draenei dead have become cursed spirits
column2: angry and confused with a burning hatred for the living. Enter the tomb and seek out these tragic victims. Give them the rest that they deserve.

column1: Since Time Forgotten...^68^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Leoroxx^Leoroxx^Understanding the Mok'Nathal^^^Slay Gnosh Brognat
column2: leader of the ogres at the Bladespire Outpost.^Since time forgotten we have fought with the Bladespire ogres. We have managed to push them back so that now they only hold a tenuous grip at Bladespire Outpost. It's back the way that you came
column3: on the southwestern edge of the Razor Ridge. Prove your worth to me by killing their leader
column4: Gnosh Brognat. Let us see what stuff you are made of when fighting the ogres.

column1: Slay the Brood Mother^68^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Leoroxx^Leoroxx^Understanding the Mok'Nathal^^^Slay Dreadwing.^My hunters have just returned from a scouting mission to the Singing Ridge. It seems that the nether drakes
column2: which infest the crystals there
column3: have increased greatly in number
column4: and threaten to spill out into our laps. Since you have proven yourself a competent slayer
column5: let us see if your <class> skills are the match of an adult drake. Find the Singing Ridge by heading south through the Scalewing Shelf. Enter and slay their brood mother
column6: Dreadwing.

column1: Understanding the Mok'Nathal^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Leoroxx^Leoroxx^Understanding the Mok'Nathal^The Stones of Vekh'nir^The Totems of My Enemy^Slay Vekh
column2: leader of the Vekh'nir arakkoa.^<Leoroxx looks you in the eye with the kind of stare that chills your soul.> You come to the Mok'Nathal
column3: but you do not understand us. You do not understand our struggle to survive. If you would understand us
column4: then you will have to endure a taste of that struggle. To the south are the Vekh'nir arakkoa. They have enslaved a group of ogres in the caverns known as Trogma's Claim and their leader
column5: Vekh is in there. Slay him!

column1: The Eyes of Skettis^62^All^Terokkar Forest^Rilak the Redeemed^Rilak the Redeemed^Surrender to the Horde^^^Bring the Eye of Reskk and the Eye of Shienor to Rilak the Redeemed in the Lower City section of Shattrath City.^Doom harkens from the cliffs of Skettis. My people
column2: the arakkoa
column3: face a fate shrouded in unspeakable evil. Too often have we abused dark magic for wrongdoing. Through A'dal I have learned of the Light and of redemption. Terokk watches his colonies from Skettis through orbs enchanted by the black art. Steal these Eyes from Veil Reskk and Veil Shienor in northern Terokkar. Let me see what Terokk sees. Let me look through the eyes of Skettis.

column1: Veil Rhaze: Unliving Evil^64^All^Terokkar Forest^Kirrik the Awakened^Kirrik the Awakened^Surrender to the Horde^^^Kill 4 Deathtalon Spirits
column2: 4 Screeching Spirits and 2 Spirit Ravens and return to Kirrik the Awakened at the Refugee Caravan.^Veil Rhaze was a particularly wicked colony of Skettis. Despite the village's eradication by the Auchindoun disaster
column3: Terokk's influence remained in the maligned spirits there. Travel west to Veil Rhaze and slay those murderous wretches. You'll find them to the west of the Shadow Tomb
