column4: on the border of Bone Wastes and Terokkar Forest. This will be our first blow against Terokk and the guardians of Skettis.

column1: Seek Out Kirrik^63^All^Terokkar Forest^Rilak the Redeemed^Kirrik the Awakened^Surrender to the Horde^^The Tomb of Lights
column2: Vengeful Souls
column3: Missing Friends^Take Rilak's Missive to Kirrik the Awakened at the Refugee Caravan in the Bone Wastes.^Other arakkoa took part in the betrayal of Terokk. Kirrik recognized Terokk as a charlatan
column4: not a prophet. The only prophecy Terokk envisioned was the doom borne of his own bidding. It was Kirrik who led us bravely from Skettis. After our pilgrimage to Shattrath
column5: Kirrik traveled to the colonies in search of others. This missive tells of what the Eyes have seen. Kirrik must be told! Follow the road south out of Shattrath to the Bone Wastes and look for the caravan.

column1: The Totems of My Enemy^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Spiritcaller Dohgar^Spiritcaller Dohgar^The Totems of My Enemy^Understanding the Mok'Nathal^^Collect 5 Bladespire Totems.^There is the right way to honor one's ancestors
column2: and there is the wrong way. The Bladespire ogres carry totems with them
column3: but they do not use them to show their respect. Instead
column4: they seek to use them to manipulate and control. We should steal their totems because they are unworthy! We will then put them to better use. Go to the Bladespire Outpost to the west
column5: just southwest of the Razor Ridge. Slay the Bladespire mystics and crushers
column6: and take their totems from them!

column1: Missing Friends^64^All^Terokkar Forest^Ethan^Ethan^^Seek Out Kirrik^^Ethan wants you to find 12 of his missing friends in Veil Skith and then return to him at the Refugee Caravan.^We broke down here because some guys came in the night and made a lot of noise. It was scary. I don't know when we are going to get moving again. Some of my friends are missing though. I don't know where they are. I think those scary bird men took them away to the northwest. They probably are all locked up in cages and stuff. If you find them that would be great. I'm kind of worried about them.

Spirit Calling^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Spiritcaller Dohgar^Spiritcaller Dohgar^The Totems of My Enemy^^^Use the Spirit Calling Totems to collect 8 Lesser Nether Drake Spirits.^The spirits of the nether drakes in the Singing Ridge are in need of liberation. The nether drakes were not always nether drakes. They used to be black drakes. But then
column2: with the destruction of this world
column3: a wave of nether energy washed over everything and had the side-effect of changing the drakeling eggs. Now they are all twisted versions of their former selves. We must help them to find peace. Do this by slaying a drake near to the spirit calling totem
column4: and then take its spirit from it.

column1: The Force of Neltharaku^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Neltharaku^Neltharaku^Kindness^^^Neltharaku
column2: flying high above Netherwing Fields in Shadowmoon Valley
column3: wants you to free 5 Enslaved Netherwing Drakes.^Take this enchanted nethervine crystal and make your way back to Dragonmaw Fortress. Once there
column4: seek out the enslaved drakes and invoke the magic of the nethervine crystal. My own energies will pour forth
column5: causing the drakes to break free from the bond of their captors. When you see that the drake has broken free
column6: help it defeat its captor! It will most assuredly be weak from the imprisonment. Release all that you can find and return to me
column7: <name>.

column1: Fel Reavers
column2: No Thanks!^69^All^Netherstorm^Nether-Stalker Nauthis^Nether-Stalker Nauthis^Fel Reavers
column3: No Thanks!^^^Obtain 5 Condensed Nether Gas from Gan'arg Mekgineers at Forge Base: Oblivion
column4: northwest of the Stormspire
column5: and load them into a nearby Inactive Fel Reaver. Return to Nether-Stalker Nauthis after you've completed this task.^Ah
column6: yes - the fel reaver! Certainly the Legion's most terrible mechanical creation. There are no less than three of these abominations aimed at the Stormspire. Fortunately for us
column7: they are not active yet. This affords us the possibility of dealing with them through sabotage instead of brute force. Obtain condensed nether gas from the gan'arg at Forge Base: Oblivion and fill a nearby fel reaver's fuel tank with it. I've a feeling its engine won't handle it too well.

column1: The Best Defense^69^All^Netherstorm^Nether-Stalker Nauthis^Nether-Stalker Nauthis^Fel Reavers
column2: No Thanks!^^^Nether-Stalker Nauthis wants you to slay 12 Wrathbringers at Forge Base: Gehenna
column3: north of the Stormspire.^Brave acts of industrial sabotage will only get us so far
column4: <name>. Just as Forge Base: Oblivion serves as an assembly site for Fel Reavers
column5: Forge Base: Gehenna serves as a staging ground for their army as it is where the majority of the Legion's teleportation devices are located. I want you to go in there and put a dent in their numbers. They must have a full regiment of wrathbringers by now and we just can't allow that.

column1: Teleport This!^69^All^Netherstorm^Nether-Stalker Nauthis^Nether-Stalker Nauthis^Fel Reavers
column2: No Thanks!^^^Nether-Stalker Nauthis wants you to use the Mental Interference Rod on the Mo'arg at Forge Base: Gehenna and use their Detonate Teleporter ability on the three teleporters in the forge camp.^As fun as killing demons might be
column3: it does us little good when the Legion can keep using its teleporters to replace anything we kill. Unfortunately
column4: I don't have any high-powered explosives handy... but the mo'arg that maintain the teleporters do. Take this rod... I've tuned its powers to interfere with mo'arg brain frequencies. Return to Forge Base: Gehenna and use it on any mo'arg you see. You won't have long
column5: but you'll be able to use their demolition charges on the nearby teleporters.

column1: Karynaku^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Neltharaku^Karynaku^Kindness^^Zuluhed the Whacked^Seek out Karynaku at Dragonmaw Fortress.^It shames me to ask for your assistance once more
column2: <name>
column3: but you are my flight's only hope. Without my mate
column4: the netherwing brood may die out completely. Make your way to the top of Dragonmaw Fortress and find Karynaku. We will be flying overhead. Should a break appear in their defenses
column5: the might of the netherwing will swoop down to assist you.

column1: Gather the Orbs^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Spiritcaller Dohgar^Spiritcaller Dohgar^The Totems of My Enemy^^^Use the Orb Collecting Totem to collect 15 Razaani Light Orbs.^The Razaani ethereals have strange devices that emit small
column2: pink floating light orbs. They remind me of souls. They are not to be confused with the large yellow balls that break free of the ethereal when they die
column3: these are something else entirely. I'd like for you to head north to Razaan's Landing and drop some totems
column4: which will attact the pink light orbs. Bring them back to me so that I might determine exactly what they are.

column1: Mok'Nathal Treats^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Matron Varah^Matron Varah^^^^Collect 3 Raptor Ribs and 3 Serpent Flesh.^Hungry
column2: <race>? The Great Spirit helps those that help themselves. If you want to earn a meal
column3: I suggest that you listen up
column4: because Braagor there isn't going to give you anything for free
column5: nor as tasty! The raptors and scalewings of Razor Ridge and the Scalewing Shelf have everything that's needed for two of the most delicious dishes you'll ever taste. Bring me their raptor ribs and serpent flesh
column6: and I'll make some of each for you. I may even teach you how to cook them up for yourself
column7: if you hurry.

column1: Veil Lithic: Preemptive Strike^64^All^Terokkar Forest^Kirrik the Awakened^Kirrik the Awakened^Surrender to the Horde^^^Break the cursed eggs in Veil Lithic. Redeem 3 Hatchlings and slay 3 Malevolent Hatchlings before returning to Kirrik the Awakened at the Refugee Caravan.^In the wretched colony to the southwest known as Veil Lithic
column2: Terokk's minions are attempting to befoul their avian brethren before they hatch. The dark sorcerers of Lithic encase eggs in a shadowy curse. When the hatchlings emerge
column3: they mindlessly serve Terrok. Travel to Veil Lithic and prematurely break the eggs before the curse has time to seep in. Even if you are too late
column4: you can put down the tainted ones. Remember
column5: the Light shines brightest in the darkness.

column1: Surrender to the Horde^63^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Rokag^Rilak the Redeemed^Surrender to the Horde^^The Eyes of Skettis^Rokag wants you to seek out Rilak the Redeemed in the Lower City section of Shattrath City and demand that he and his people surrender to the Horde.^The cowardly arakkoa attack us daily. They ambush our hunters and sometimes even raid inside our walls. We kill them when we can
column2: but their magic is strong and they often escape our warbands. I have learned that some arakkoa claim to be friendly with the Horde. They live in Shattrath City to the northwest. Rilak the Redeemed is their leader. Search for him in the Lower City
column3: and when you find him
column4: demand his surrender.

column1: Secrets of the Arakkoa^63^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Lady Dena Kennedy^Rilak the Redeemed^Secrets of the Arakkoa^^The Eyes of Skettis^Lady Dena Kennedy wants you to seek out Rilak the Redeemed in the Lower City section of Shattrath City and find out what secrets he will share of the Arakkoa.^Out here on the frontier we have to deal with the arakkoa every day. They strike at us when they please
column2: raiding our supply lines and killing our scouts. Yet we know very little about these enigmatic creatures. I have received news that northwest of here in Shattrath City there are arakkoa who are not hostile. They might be willing to share the secrets of their race. Rilak the Redeemed is their leader. He resides in the northern part of the Lower City.

column1: A Burden of Souls^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Apothecary Antonivich^Apothecary Antonivich^Boiling Blood^^^Kill 20 Shattered Hand orcs
column2: then return to Apothecary Antonivich in Thrallmar.^I have a device
column3: the Demoniac Scryer
column4: that can analyze fel magic. I would have you use the Scryer
column5: but first... you must appease it. The Scryer
column6: you see
column7: has trapped within it a creature of vast intelligence and its needs are
column8: shall we say
column9: quite eccentric. To appease the Scryer
column10: you must kill orcs. Specifically
column11: they must be Shattered Hand orcs -- the Scryer demands their souls. Return to me when the souls are reaped. You will find the orcs north
column12: and south
column13: and surrounding... Hellfire Citadel.

column1: Inform Leoroxx!^68^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Spiritcaller Dohgar^Leoroxx^The Totems of My Enemy^^There Can Be Only One Response^Speak with Leoroxx about what the Razaani ethereal are up to. He can be found at Mok'Nathal Village in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^Quickly
column2: you must inform Leoroxx of what is transpiring up at Razaan's Landing! Those orbs were comprised of souls
column3: some of them Mok'Nathal!

column1: Zuluhed the Whacked^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Karynaku^Karynaku^Zuluhed the Whacked^Karynaku^^Kill Zuluhed the Whacked and recover Zuluhed's Key. Use Zuluhed's Key on Zuluhed's Chains to free Karynaku.^He hides in my thoughts
column2: mortal. He waits for me to break... for me to bend to his will. And this will be his undoing. I will call for him. I will tell him that I will do as he asks. When he appears
column3: kill him and take the key! Know this: Zuluhed is an ancient orc with unknown powers. He has surely been empowered further by Illidan. You risk your life for me in doing as I ask. Are you certain you wish to make such a sacrifice?

column1: There Can Be Only One Response^68^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Leoroxx^Spiritcaller Dohgar^^Inform Leoroxx!^^Collect the Collection of Souls.^There can be only one response to this... this
column2: DEFILEMENT of the souls of our ancestors! <name>
column3: if you would aid us to restore the souls of our honored dead to their rightful place
column4: go back to Razaan's Landing. Go back up there and kill the razaani until their leader
column5: Nexus-Prince Razaan shows his cowardly face. Kill him and get those souls back
column6: and then give them over to Spiritcaller Dohgar!

column1: Arakkoa War Path^62^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Advisor Faila^Advisor Faila^^^^Advisor Faila asks that you kill 14 Shienor Talonites and 6 Shienor Sorcerers and then return to her in Stonebreaker Hold.^The arakkoa have attacked us again
column2: this time striking in the night and then using their dark magic to escape before we could charge out to meet them in numbers. They use their summoning circles to rescue their warriors from certain death but they cannot run from us if we attack their homes. Veil Reskk and Veil Shienor lie to the north and northeast. Find these arakkoa nests and kill as many as you can.

column1: Thin the Flock^62^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Lieutenant Gravelhammer^Lieutenant Gravelhammer^^^^Lieutenant Gravelhammer asks that you kill 14 Shienor Talonites and 6 Shienor Sorcerers and then return to him in Allerian Stronghold.^The arakkoa have attacked us again
column2: this time striking in the night and then using their dark magic to escape before we could marshal our soldiers. Veil Reskk and Veil Shienor lie to the north and northwest. Find these arakkoa nests and kill as many as you can. They may not fear us
column3: but at least we can thin their numbers.

column1: Ally of the Netherwing^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Karynaku^Mordenai^Zuluhed the Whacked^^Blood Oath of the Netherwing^Let Karynaku return you to Mordenai in the Netherwing Fields.^Allow me to return you to Mordenai. I am certain that he wishes to see you once more.

Taken in the Night^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Scout Navrin^Scout Navrin^^^^Scout Navrin wants you to travel to the Netherweb Ridge and free 6 Webbed Sha'tar Warriors and then return to him at Sha'tari Base Camp.^Our small outpost is under constant attack. Several nights ago
column2: we were raided by the spiders of Netherweb Ridge
column3: on the southeastern edge of the Bone Wastes. They poisoned many of our people
column4: wrapped them in webs and carried them away. Some of our warriors took up arms and with little preparation pursued the spiders. We have not seen the captives or our hunting parties since. We hope that some may still be alive
column5: perhaps imprisoned by the spiders. Our numbers are few. Will you search for our people?

column1: Veil Shalas: Signal Fires^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Kirrik the Awakened^Kirrik the Awakened^Surrender to the Horde^^^Kirrik the Awakened at the Refugee Caravan wants you to extinguish the four signal fires of Veil Shalas.^Terokk's perch
column2: Skettis
column3: looms above the Bone Wastes to the east. At the base of Skettis lies Veil Shalas
column4: the most formidable of Terokk's colonies. It is through the stronghold of Veil Shalas that Terokk's forward sages wage war against the Light. The evil-doers of Shalas communicate with their master using a complex system of magical signal fires. Travel to the east
column5: <race>
column6: and extinguish the fires. Once Veil Shalas is silenced
column7: we can begin to plot the fall of Skettis. But I get ahead of myself.

column1: Report to Nazgrel^61^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Apothecary Antonivich^Nazgrel^Boiling Blood^^^Speak with Nazgrel at Thrallmar in Hellfire Peninsula.^<name>
column2: during your foray with the Demoniac Scryer
column3: I sent word of your exploits against the fel orcs. Nazgrel
column4: our illustrious leader in Thrallmar
column5: wishes to speak with you. I believe he has a bloody mission in mind...

column1: The Foot of the Citadel^63^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Nazgrel^Nazgrel^Boiling Blood^^^Kill Force Commander Gorax
column2: place the Challenge From the Horde upon his corpse
column3: kill The Hand of Kargath
column4: and then bring the Head of the Hand of Kargath to Nazgrel in Thrallmar.^Force Commander Gorax is training Shattered Hand captains at the base of Hellfire Citadel
column5: honing them to a bloody razor's edge. You must kill him
column6: <name>
column7: for his loss would be a mighty blow to the fel orcs. However
column8: that is not all you must do. Take this banner. Place it atop Gorax's corpse. Gorax's commander
column9: the Hand of Kargath
column10: must answer your challenge if he has even a drop of true orc blood within him! His head
column11: the head of the hand of Kargath
column12: is what I seek.

column1: The Dread Relic^66^All^Terokkar Forest^Oakun^Oakun^The Dread Relic^^^Oakun wants you to travel east to the Derelict Caravan to recover the Dread Relic. Return to Oakun when the task is complete.^Long ago a caravan went to Auchindoun with a mission to take a Dread Relic from the ancient tombs beneath the necropolis. They fled
column2: but the relic was their undoing. The relic is evil and it summons evil when touched. Their caravan was destroyed somewhere to the east. This dark artifact is the key to a terrible plan to defeat Teribus the Cursed
column3: a creature that flies over the Bone Wastes. Help me if you wish
column4: but your life and even your soul will be at risk.

column1: Before Darkness Falls^63^All^Terokkar Forest^Mekeda^Mekeda^^^^Mekeda at the Refugee Caravan wants you to kill 8 Cabal Skirmishers
column2: 4 Cabal Spell-Weavers and 2 Cabal Initiates.^After our caravan fell prey to an attack by Shadow Council cabal cultists
column3: scouts were sent to Shattrath to call for help. The guards think we're safe for now
column4: but they underestimate these madmen. I
column5: for one
column6: am not looking forward to having my throat slit by some cabal initiate in the middle of the night. Do us all a favor and take the fight to them
column7: before they come to us. You will find our attackers south of here
column8: at Auchindoun's northern entrance.

column1: The Skettis Offensive^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Defender Grashna^Rilak the Redeemed^^Return to Shattrath^^Hold off the attackers and speak with Rilak the Redeemed.^Skettis has waged war on us! Have you gathered enough to help with Shattrath's defense? Hold off the attackers!

Cabal Orders^64^All^Terokkar Forest^Cabal Orders^Mekeda^Cabal Orders^^^Bring the Cabal Orders to Mekeda at the Refugee Caravan in the Bone Wastes.^This message bears a dark seal and though the language seems somewhat familiar
column2: it appears to be encoded. Perhaps someone at the Refugee Caravan will know something about it.

column1: The Shadow Tomb^64^All^Terokkar Forest^Mekeda^Mekeda^Cabal Orders^^^Go into the Shadow Tomb
column2: west of the Refugee Caravan and retrieve the Drape of Arunen
column3: the Gavel of K'alen and the Scroll of Atalor. Return to Mekeda at the Refugee Caravan after you've completed this task.^Many believe it was the Shadow Council that caused the explosion that tore Auchindoun apart. It is rumored they awoke a great evil inside. If that is true
column4: then that evil must have turned against them. According to these orders
column5: part of the Shadow Council is fleeing Auchindoun. They are using the Shadow Tomb to store powerful artifacts from Auchindoun. Three of these are sacred
column6: for they belonged to the powerful patriarchs Arunen
column7: K'alen and Atalor. I must ask you to retrieve them.

column1: Harbinger of Doom^70^All^Tempest Keep^A'dal^A'dal^Special Delivery to Shattrath City^^^You have been tasked to go to Tempest Keep's Arcatraz satellite and slay Harbinger Skyriss. Return to A'dal at the Terrace of Light in Shattrath City after you have done so.^<A discordant note can be detected in A'dal's 'voice'.> Prince Kael'thas has chosen his warden poorly
column2: and now the entities that we kept locked up within the Arcatraz are breaking free. One in particular
column3: a servant of the Old Gods known as Harbinger Skyriss
column4: seeks to usher in his masters' vision of conquering all of the worlds in the universe. <name>
column5: you must not allow him to escape. Return to Tempest Keep
column6: enter the Arcatraz
column7: and slay Harbinger Skyriss before it is too late!

column1: The Tempest Key^70^All^Shattrath City^Khadgar^A'dal^^The Cipher of Damnation^Trial of the Naaru: Mercy
column2: Trial of the Naaru: Strength
column3: Trial of the Naaru: Tenacity^Speak with A'dal in Shattrath City.^You have proven yourself capable of great feats
column4: <name>. Your discovery of the Cipher of Damnation and Kael'Thas' involvement is most important to our cause. Should Kael use the cipher
column5: what little is left of this world may collapse. A'dal is convinced that Kael must be stopped and now seeks adventurers willing to undergo trials. Those that prove their strength will be granted favor by the naaru. <Khadgar nods.> A'dal awaits...

column1: Trial of the Naaru: Mercy^70^All^Shattrath City^A'dal^A'dal^^The Tempest Key^Trial of the Naaru: Magtheridon^A'dal in Shattrath City wants you to recover the Unused Axe of the Executioner from the Shattered Halls of Hellfire Citadel.^Four trials you must pass before you are deemed worthy by the naaru. Within the Shattered Halls of Hellfire Citadel are three of your people. They are held there by the merciless one
column2: Kargath Bladefist. He seeks to execute them as a sign of his virility and power. You must save these prisoners before such an atrocity can come to pass. As proof of deed
column3: bring me the unused axe of the executioner. It must not have a drop of blood on its blade!

column1: Trial of the Naaru: Strength^70^All^Shattrath City^A'dal^A'dal^^The Tempest Key^Trial of the Naaru: Magtheridon^A'dal in Shattrath City wants you to recover Kalithresh's Trident and Murmur's Essence.^Four trials you must pass before you are deemed worthy by the naaru. The trial of strength is divided in two. You must destroy the leader of the Coilfang Steamvaults
column2: Warlord Kalithresh
column3: and bring me his trident. Slay the extra-planar being known as Murmur
column4: in the Shadow Labyrinth of Auchindoun
column5: and bring me his essence. Do this and you will have passed the trial of strength.

column1: Trial of the Naaru: Tenacity^70^All^Shattrath City^A'dal^A'dal^^The Tempest Key^Trial of the Naaru: Magtheridon^A'dal in Shattrath City wants you to rescue Millhouse Manastorm from the Arcatraz of Tempest Keep.^Four trials you must pass before you are deemed worthy by the naaru. In our travels we have encountered many dangerous beings. Some of these beings we incarcerated and placed in what is now known as the Arcatraz of Tempest Keep. There is one prisoner
column2: however
column3: that is a victim of circumstance. A stowaway who was in the wrong naaru vessel at the wrong time. Venture to the Arcatraz and rescue the gnome
column4: Millhouse Manastorm. Ensure his survival.

column1: Escaping the Tomb^64^All^Terokkar Forest^Akuno^Mekeda^^^^Help Akuno find his way to the Refugee Caravan. Speak to Mekeda after you've completed this quest.^I appreciate your help
column2: <name>. I was certain I was going to be killed. Let's get out of here with a hurry. It won't be long before more cultists come after us.

column1: Return to Shattrath^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Kirrik the Awakened^Rilak the Redeemed^Surrender to the Horde^^The Skettis Offensive^Travel to Shattrath City and speak with Rilak the Redeemed in the Lower City.^Your actions
column2: while brave
column3: will surely rouse a vindictive response from Terokk. Hurry to Shattrath. Send word to Rilak!

column1: Imperial Plate Armor^50^Alliance^Blacksmithing^Myolor Sunderfury^Derotain Mudsipper^^^^Speak with Derotain Mudsipper at Gadgetzan in Tanaris.^There's a dwarf in Gadgetzan by the name of Derotain Mudsipper who'll teach you how to make imperial plate armor. All you gotta do is get to the Tanaris desert and find him. Interested?

Imperial Plate Armor^50^Horde^Blacksmithing^Krathok Moltenfist^Derotain Mudsipper^^^^Speak with Derotain Mudsipper at Gadgetzan in Tanaris.^There's a dwarf in Gadgetzan by the name of Derotain Mudsipper who'll teach you how to make imperial plate armor. All you gotta do is get to the Tanaris desert and find him. Interested?
Longtail is the Lynchpin^67^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Watcher Moonshade^Watcher Moonshade^Wyrmskull Watcher^^^Slay Draaca Longtail
column2: the leader of the wyrmcultists in the Wyrmskull Tunnel.^With the Blackwing wyrmcultists massing in the tunnel
column3: we're hard pressed to deal with the situation. Quite frankly
column4: they have the numbers. And while we've been able to take care of any of their people that get too close
column5: the fact remains that if they attack in earnest
column6: we're going to be overrun. The situation calls for someone to get through to the other end of the tunnel
column7: and take out their leader
column8: Draaca Longtail. Up for some fun?

column1: Wyrmskull Watcher^67^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Tree Warden Chawn^Watcher Moonshade^Wyrmskull Watcher^Did You Get The Note?^^Deliver the Meeting Note to Watcher Moonshade at the entrance of the Wyrmskull Tunnel in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^Hmm
column2: I'm not certain what we should do. I'm not much of a military planner. Watcher Moonshade will know what to do. He's heading up our defensive efforts at the Wyrmskull Tunnel to the west at the end of Wyrmskull Bridge. We have a force out there just in case the cultists try anything funny. Please
column3: take the note to him with all due haste.

column1: Zeth'Gor Must Burn!^60^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Wing Commander Dabir'ee^Wing Commander Dabir'ee^^^^Use the smoke beacon at each of Zeth'Gor's towers
column2: and then return to Wing Commander Dabir'ee at Expedition Point.^It's time to strike Zeth'Gor from the air! Our gryphon riders are ready for a sortie
column3: <name>. But they need someone on the ground to direct their fire. Are you ready for a covert mission? Take these smoke beacons into Zeth'Gor
column4: the Bleeding Hollow stronghold to the west. They have four guard towers: one near their northern wall
column5: one near their southern wall
column6: one near their forge and another nestled in their foothills. Place a beacon underneath each of the towers and we'll fly in and bomb them!

column1: The Infested Protectors^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Lakotae^Lakotae^^^^Lakotae wants you to kill 25 Wood Mites and then return to him at the Refugee Caravan. The mites can be found living inside the bodies of Rotting Forest-Ragers and Infested Root-Walkers.^The trees of this land are ravaged by the power that was unleashed from Auchindoun. The foul magic that was unleashed blasted the land into the wastes you see all around. The trees that survived are now infested with wretched wood mites that crawl under their bark and gnaw at their flesh. Rotting forest-rages and infested root-walkers are breeding grounds for the mites. They are found along the edge of the wood to the east. Destroy these creatures and then kill the mites that flee their husks.

Master of Potions^70^All^Alchemy^Lauranna Thar'well^Lauranna Thar'well^Master of Potions^^^Lauranna Thar'well wants you to go to the Botanica in Tempest Keep and retrieve the Botanist's Field Guide from High Botanist Freywinn. In addition she also wants you to bring her 5 Super Healing Potions
column2: 5 Super Mana Potions and 5 Major Dreamless Sleep Potions.^As you know
column3: plants have properties that allow alchemists to re-energize and reinvigorate others through potions. My familiarity with the plants of Outland allows me to teach alchemists how to make the most out of them. If you're interested in expanding your knowledge of potions
column4: I have but one task to ask of you. High Botanist Freywinn in Tempest Keep is rumored to have written a comprehensive botany guide. Bring it to me along with samples of your work and I'll teach you the knowledge you seek.

column1: Skywing^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Skywing^Rilak the Redeemed^^^^Escort Skywing and report to Rilak the Redeemed in Shattrath City.^Skywing flutters around you. You get the feeling he wants you to follow him.

Master of Transmutation^70^All^Alchemy^Zarevhi^Zarevhi^Master of Transmutation^^^Zarevhi at the Stormspire in Netherstorm wants you to bring him 4 Primal Mights.^Any alchemist will tell you that matter is malleable
column2: any substance can be transformed into another - but nothing is really created or destroyed. A true master of transmutation can learn to overcome this limitation - and I can teach you how to obtain this mastery! As a prospective transmuter you're undoubtedly familiar with primal might - the combination of the material representation of all primal forces. Show me proof of your transmuting prowess and I will share my knowledge with you.

column1: The Cudgel of Kar'desh^70^All^The Slave Pens^Skar'this the Heretic^Skar'this the Heretic^^The Mark of Vashj^^Skar'this the Heretic in the heroic Slave Pens of Coilfang Reservoir wants you to bring him the Earthen Signet and the Blazing Signet.^Bring me the elemental signets that the cudgel requires! The earthen signet is held by Gruul the Dragonkiller. Gruul can be found inside his lair in the Blade's Edge Mountains. The second signet is the blazing heart of a creature known as Nightbane. This mythical beast is said to reside in the hallowed halls of the prophet
column2: Medivh. Make haste!

column1: Master of Elixirs^70^All^Alchemy^Lorokeem^Lorokeem^Master of Elixirs^^^Go to the Black Morass in the Caverns of Time and obtain 10 Essences of Infinity from Rift Lords and Rift Keepers. Bring these along with 5 Elixirs of Major Defense
column2: 5 Elixirs of Mastery and 5 Elixirs of Major Agility to Lorokeem in Shattrath's Lower City.^I've devoted my life to perfecting my elixirs. Despite my success
column3: I haven't been able to create an elixir of eternal life. I think I know the reagent I'm missing. I've heard of a place called the Caverns of Time in Azeroth where intruders known as rift lords and rift keepers phase in and out of the timeline. This intrusive time-shifting creates tears in time itself
column4: twisting it infinitely into crystallized essences. Bring these to me along with samples of your work and I'll teach you all I know.

column1: Return to Honor Hold^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Corporal Ironridge^Assistant Klatu^Cursed Talismans^^Fel Spirits
column2: Digging for Prayer Beads^Speak with Assistant Klatu
column3: at Honor Hold's inn.^<name>
column4: while you were on your mission in Zeth'Gor
column5: I received news of my commanding officer
column6: Colonel Jules. He was stricken with a demonic corruption while fighting near the Gor'gaz Outpost
column7: and his situation has grown very bad. You have made such great gains for us against the fel orcs. Your strength in battle is without question... is your spirit just as strong? Please
column8: return to Honor Hold and speak with Klatu
column9: in an upper room at the Honor Hold inn.

column1: Harvesting the Fel Ammunition^68^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Evergrove Druid^Evergrove Druid^Damaged Mask^^^Collect 5 Fel Cannonballs.^We must shut down the Burning Legion's access to Death's Door
column2: but first you're going to destroy their two warp-gates! The problem is
column3: we can't even scratch one of those things
column4: so you're going to need to use their own weapons against them. The death's might
column5: death's watch
column6: deathforge over-smiths and deathforge technicians carry the ammunition for the fel cannons. Normally it wouldn't affect any of them
column7: but if you bring the cannonballs to me
column8: I will imbue them with Nature's unbridled wrath!

column1: Master of Potions^70^All^Alchemy^Apothecary Antonivich^Lauranna Thar'well^Master of Potions^^Master of Potions^Speak to Lauranna Thar'well at Cenarion Refuge in Zangarmarsh.^My knowledge of alchemy is vast. It is
column2: however
column3: general in nature. If you wish to specialize
column4: you will have to find others who have narrower fields of study. If you wish to specialize in potion creation
column5: I would recommend that you seek the help of Lauranna Thar'well of the Cenarion Expedition. Her knowledge of plants will allow you to make the most of your raw materials. Look for her in Zangarmarsh and tell her I sent you to her.

column1: Master of Elixirs^70^All^Alchemy^Apothecary Antonivich^Lorokeem^Master of Elixirs^^Master of Potions^Speak to Lorokeem in Shattrath's Lower City.^My knowledge of alchemy is vast. It is
column2: however
column3: general in nature. If you wish to specialize
column4: you will have to find others who have narrower fields of study. If you wish to specialize in elixir creation
column5: I would recommend that you seek the help of the arakkoa known as Lorokeem. His knowledge of elixirs is unmatched
column6: yet he squanders his skill pursuing an elixir of eternal life. Find him and see what he can teach you.

column1: Master of Transmutation^70^All^Alchemy^Apothecary Antonivich^Zarevhi^Master of Transmutation^^Master of Potions^Speak to Zarevhi at the Stormspire in Netherstorm.^My knowledge of alchemy is vast. It is
column2: however
column3: general in nature. If you wish to specialize
column4: you will have to find others who have narrower fields of study. If you wish to specialize in transmutation
column5: I would recommend that you seek the help of the ethereal known as Zarevhi. He resides in the Stormspire in Netherstorm. His mastery of transmutation is... well
column6: outlandish! See what you can learn from him
column7: but beware - ethereals drive a hard bargain.

column1: Speak with Rilak the Redeemed^63^All^Terokkar Forest^Kirrik the Awakened^Rilak the Redeemed^Speak with Rilak the Redeemed^^The Eyes of Skettis^Kirrik the Awakened wants you to speak with Rilak the Redeemed in the Lower City section of Shattrath City.^You look surprised to be talking to me. I do not blame you. My people
column2: the arakkoa
column3: deserve to be feared. Speak with Rilak the Redeemed in Shattrath City if you wish to know more. He can be found in the northern part of the Lower City
column4: with the other outcasts of Skettis. And
column5: <name>
column6: we will speak again.

column1: Fel Spirits^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Assistant Klatu^Assistant Klatu^^Return to Honor Hold^The Exorcism of Colonel Jules^Klatu in Honor Hold wants you to use the Anchorite Relic at Gor'gaz Outpost southwest of Honor Hold
column2: slay Shattered Hand Berserkers near the relic
column3: and then slay 10 released Fel Spirits to avenge Colonel Jules.^Colonel Jules was cursed in a battle near the Gor'gaz Outpost
column4: a haunt for Shattered Hand fel orcs. My master
column5: Barada
column6: works feverishly to cure the poor human
column7: but he needs help. The Colonel's tormented spirit seeks peace
column8: and his path to peace is
column9: I fear
column10: a path of vengeance. Take this anchorite relic to Gor'gaz Outpost. Place it upon the ground near Shattered Hand orcs and defeat them. This will release their fel spirits -- you must slay those fel spirits for Jules' own spirit's recovery.

column1: Death's Door^68^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Wildlord Antelarion^Evergrove Druid^Damaged Mask^^^Use the Druid Signal at Death's Door to call down and speak with an Evergrove Druid.^Now there is an even greater threat from the Burning Legion. To the south is a portal known as Death's Door
column2: which opens upon the horrific world where the Legion breeds its deadly hounds. To get there
column3: exit Evergrove by heading east up the ramp. Follow the path south
column4: through the Bladed Gulch
column5: Razaan's Landing
column6: Razor Ridge and the Scalewing Shelf. Then
column7: take the ramp down into the Vekhaar Stand and enter Death's Door through the tunnel
column8: south of Mok'Nathal. Once there
column9: use this druid signal.

column1: Fire At Will!^68^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Evergrove Druid^Evergrove Druid^Damaged Mask^^^Use the Naturalized Ammunition to take control of the Death's Door Fel Cannons. Use the cannons to destroy both the South Warp-Gate and the North Warp-Gate.^Now that the ammunition can affect the Burning Legion
column2: it's time for you to use it. There are two warp-gates
column3: which are used for teleportation and enhancement of the void terrors. One is in the south and the other in the north
column4: and each is within range of a fel cannon. Use the naturalized ammunition to take control of each fel cannon and destroy the warp-gates. Attack the gate with artillery to begin
column5: and be prepared to kill its defenders to keep the cannon alive if necessary.

column1: The Hound-Master^68^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Evergrove Druid^Wildlord Antelarion^Damaged Mask^^^Slay Baelmon the Hound-Master.^Baelmon the Hound-Master must die! He maintains the ritual that keeps the portal functioning. The Death's Door portal is located at the north end of the canyon. When you find it
column2: you will find Baelmon. You're going to need help on this one
column3: so take this wand. When you battle the Hound-Master
column4: use it and a couple of my friends will come to your aid. After you have defeated Baelmon
column5: return to Wildlord Antelarion. And
column6: <name>
column7: thank you for all that you've gone through for us here.

column1: An Improper Burial^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Commander Ra'vaj^Commander Ra'vaj^An Improper Burial^^^Commander Ra'vaj at the Sha'tari Outpost in the Bone Wastes of Terokkar Forest wants you to burn 8 Slain Auchenai Warriors and 8 Slain Sha'tar Vindicators.^Is there nothing that can be done to stem the tide of corruption? My soldiers have been battling the Auchenai for days now with no end in sight. Each casualty
column2: whether Auchenai or Sha'tar
column3: is snatched from the battlefield - their souls lifted and taken to parts unknown. I will not have it! A proper burial is out of the question but those fiends will not have their souls! Take this torch and travel to the field of battle
column4: directly east of here. Burn every corpse you see! We will not fuel their rituals.

column1: A Hero Is Needed^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Commander Ra'vaj^Commander Ra'vaj^An Improper Burial^^^Commander Ra'vaj at the Sha'tari Outpost in the Bone Wastes of Terokkar Forest wants you to slay 12 Auchenai Initiates and 5 Auchenai Doomsayers.^It is not enough. A hero is needed. Our forces are overwhelmed as the Auchenai continue to grow in number. <Commander Ra'vaj looks at you.> Will you be the hero? Return to the field of battle and strike at their soldiers. Keep them occupied so that my scouts can get behind their lines and see what they are creating.

The Fallen Exarch^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Commander Ra'vaj^Commander Ra'vaj^An Improper Burial^^^Commander Ra'vaj at the Sha'tari Outpost in the Bone Wastes of Terokkar Forest wants you to destroy the contents of the Auchenai Coffin.^They are feeding the souls they steal to a coffin that they have dragged out from the Auchenai Crypts. My scouts believe the contents of the coffin to contain the first exarch of the crypts. They seek to resurrect the ancient one! You must battle your way to the western side of Auchindoun and disturb the contents of that coffin before they feed it enough souls. Should you lose your way
column2: follow the walking souls. Destroy whatever is inside that coffin!

column1: Digging for Prayer Beads^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Assistant Klatu^Assistant Klatu^^Return to Honor Hold^The Exorcism of Colonel Jules^Recover the Draenei Prayer Beads and bring them to Assistant Klatu in Honor Hold.^Anchorite Barada plans to exorcise the corruption from Colonel Jules
column2: and will require an assistant for the task. Such an assistant must be prepared... I am ashamed to admit that my prayer beads were lost in Honor Hold's courtyard. I believe the dog Fei Fei stole them and buried them
column3: but I do not know where. If you speak with his master
column4: Warrant Officer Tracy Proudwell
column5: perhaps she will know where Fei Fei hides his stolen treasures.

column1: The Outcast's Plight^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Vekax^Vekax^^^More Feathers^Bring 30 Arakkoa Feathers to Vekax in Shattrath's Lower City.^As an outcast
column2: I am marked by death by arakkoa loyal to the city of Skettis. I cannot leave these walls for fear of my life
column3: but that doesn't mean I cannot strike at them in retaliation. I have a small cache of treasure that I'm willing to part with
column4: should you help me strike back at my would-be assassins. Bring me feathers from the denizens of the various Veils of Terokkar as proof of their demise.

column1: For the Fallen^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Vindicator Haylen^Vindicator Haylen^For the Fallen^^^Vindicator Haylen wants you to slay 20 Dreadfang Widows and then return to him just west of Netherweb Ridge.^When the dreadfang widows attacked our outpost we heard the voice of the naaru calling us to battle. We pursued the creatures into the night. Some of our people we found dead in the dark
column2: others we could hear struggling against their captors. By morning we had come to this place and we fought a fierce battle but we were beaten. Dreadfang poison will soon take my companions and I cannot last long. Before I die I must know that the dreadfang widows were beaten.

column1: Terokkarantula^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Vindicator Haylen^Vindicator Haylen^For the Fallen^^^Vindicator Haylen wants you to kill the Terokkarantula and then return to him west of Netherweb Ridge.^You have slain many of the dreadfang widows but they will continue to spawn and soon they will strike at us again. Deep within Netherweb Ridge is the lair of the Terokkarantula
column2: the brood-mother of these gruesome creatures. If we are to be safe
column3: she must die.

column1: Digging Through Bones^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Chief Archaeologist Letoll^Dwarfowitz^Digging Through Bones^^^Escort Letoll and his crew and protect them while they make their dig. Return to Dwarfowitz at the Sha'tari Outpost if you succeed.^Oy! You look like you can take care of yerself
column2: <race>. Me and the crew here are looking for a bodyguard to watch over us while we hit a dig site to the north. The pay is pretty good and all you gotta do is make sure no nasty creatures kill me or any of my employees. If you successfully make it back without any casualties
column3: Dwarfowitz over there will pay ya.

column1: Evil Draws Near^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Oakun^Oakun^The Dread Relic^^^Oakun wants you to take the Dread Relic to the Writhing Mound. Once there
column2: kill Auchenai Death-Speakers and Auchenai Doomsayers to collect 20 Doom Skulls. Then find the Writhing Mound Summoning Circle and use the Dread Relic to summon and destroy Teribus the Cursed. Return to Oakun when the deed is done.^Now you must use the Dread Relic in a foul necromantic ritual if you wish to challenge Teribus the Cursed. To the northeast
column3: beyond Auchindoun
column4: is the Writhing Mound
column5: a place where necromancers gather. The auchenai death-speakers and doomsayers carry doom skulls that are laced with powerful necro-enchantments. If you collect enough skulls you can use their power along with the power of the Dread Relic to command Teribus to face you.

column1: Bloody Imp-ossible!^69^All^Netherstorm^Sab'aoth^Sab'aoth^^^^Bring 8 vials of Warp Chaser Blood to Sab'aoth at Cosmowrench.^The blood of the warp chasers in this area is a powerful and rare reagent. It's one of my biggest sellers. Normally
column2: I take my imp
column3: Zeppit
column4: out to help me gather it. Warp chaser blood is simply too caustic to be handled safely by you or I
column5: but it doesn't bother Zeppit. Things are getting busier here at the shop
column6: so if I send Zeppit with you
column7: will you help gather the blood? Zeppit's attention tends to wander
column8: so you'll need to be close to the chaser when it dies for Zeppit to do his work.

column1: Return to Sha'tari Base Camp^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Vindicator Haylen^Scout Navrin^For the Fallen^^^Vindicator Haylen wants you to return to the Sha'tari Base Camp in the Bone Wastes and speak with Scout Navrin.^We will not make it back on our own. The dreadfang poison is too strong. You must return to Sha'tari Base Camp for us. Scout Navrin will send a rescue party out to find us.

Killing the Crawlers^65^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Sentinel Moonwhisper^Commander Skyshadow^^^^Slay 6 Cavern Crawlers.^Commander Skyshadow wants this tunnel cleared out so we can expedite trade with the Harborage. I must not leave my post here so I am leaving the task in your hands. Clear the tunnel and report to Commander Skyshadow at once!

Killing the Crawlers^65^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Grunt Grahk^Tor'chunk Twoclaws^^^^Slay 6 Cavern Crawlers.^Tor'chunk Twoclaws wants this tunnel cleared out so we can expedite trade with Swamp Rat. I must not leave my post here so I am leaving the task in your hands. Clear the tunnel and report to Tor'chunk Twoclaws at once!

Fumping^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Dwarfowitz^Dwarfowitz^Digging Through Bones^^^Dwarfowitz at the Sha'tari Base Camp in the Bone Wastes wants you to bring him 8 Mature Bone Sifter Carcasses.^How would you like to do a little more work for the Explorers' League? These bone worms have us all quite intrigued. I've got a drum right here that you can use out in the Bone Wastes. Just bang on the damned thing and see what you get. If it's a worm
column2: kill it and bring back the carcass for us to study. We'll need a good lot of carcasses to get a valid testing sample.

column1: The Big Bone Worm^65^All^Terokkar Forest^Dwarfowitz^Dwarfowitz^Digging Through Bones^^^Dwarfowitz at the Sha'tari Base Camp in the Bone Wastes wants you to recover Enormous Bone Worm Organs.^I was right! These carcasses you brought me belong to the baby bone worms. Do you know what that means? It means that somewhere out there is a big one! I think we can get it to come out if we can provide the right kind of food. Let's see... something big! Yes! I remember seeing clefthooves east of here on the other side of the Bone Wastes. Get out there and kill a clefthoof. Once it's dead
column2: use the drums. Hopefully the big one will come up to feed. If you manage to kill it
column3: bring me its organs!

column1: The Exorcism of Colonel Jules^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Assistant Klatu^Assistant Klatu^The Exorcism of Colonel Jules^Fel Spirits
column2: Digging for Prayer Beads^^Speak with Anchorite Barada. Use the prayer beads to help with the ritual
column3: and then speak with Colonel Jules when he is saved. Finally
column4: return to Assistant Klatu.^<name>
column5: it is time to save Colonel Jules. His condition has worsened and Barada fears that
column6: if we do not cleanse him of his corruption
column7: he will be lost to us. Take the prayer beads you found and speak with Anchorite Barada to begin the ritual. Let no disruptions stop the ritual... and if all goes well
column8: Colonel Jules will be saved. Speak with Jules when he is saved
column9: then return to me.

column1: Trollbane is Looking for You^61^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Assistant Klatu^Force Commander Danath Trollbane^The Exorcism of Colonel Jules^^^Assistant Klatu has informed you that Force Commander Danath Trollbane has been seeking you. Speak to him in the barracks at Honor Hold in Hellfire Peninsula.^While we were busy
column2: a messenger was waiting out in the hall. I suppose he grew tired
column3: or perhaps he simply ran away at the sight of Jules floating around the room. Either way
column4: Force Commander Danath is looking for you. I suggest that you seek an audience with him inside the barracks as quickly as possible!

column1: Drill the Drillmaster^62^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Force Commander Danath Trollbane^Force Commander Danath Trollbane^The Exorcism of Colonel Jules^^^Force Commander Danath Trollbane has ordered you to kill Drillmaster Zurok with all due haste. Return to the force commander at Honor Hold in the Hellfire Peninsula once the drillmaster is dead.^I'm receiving reports that the Shattered Hand fel orcs
column2: out in front of Hellfire Citadel
column3: are organizing for what looks like an all-out assault. No doubt
column4: they're not happy about your successes against all of the clans. Get to the base of the citadel
column5: where the Path of Glory ends. You'll find the fel orcs busy with their preparations
column6: but you're going to catch them with their pants down. Eliminate the one that's in charge of that force. Kill Drillmaster Zurok!

column1: The Secret Compromised^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Seer Olum^Akama^^Akama's Promise^Ruse of the Ashtongue^Travel to the Warden's Cage in Shadowmoon Valley and speak to Akama.^Thanks again
column2: <name>. I recognize your name. Akama has entrusted you with his plans and so I will trust you as well. The naga discovered I was working against Illidan and tried to get me to speak by torturing me. I did not tell them a thing - Akama himself taught me to master pain through meditation. Illidan asked the naga to bring me to him. He would have seen right through my flesh and into my soul's deepest secrets. Akama must be warned. Our plans are in jeopardy!

column1: Ruse of the Ashtongue^70^All^Tempest Keep^Akama^Akama^Ruse of the Ashtongue^The Secret Compromised^^Travel into Tempest Keep and slay Al'ar while wearing the Ashtongue Cowl. Return to Akama in Shadowmoon Valley once you've completed this task.^Olum's sacrifice was tremendous. I would never have asked him to give up his life myself. But it is done. If we're to lure Illidan back into a false sense of security
column2: we need to do his bidding - at least for now. I command a vast army of Ashtongue
column3: but - aside from the Deathsworn - none can be trusted. You are to perform the deed that Illidan demands. Take this cowl; it is magical in nature. You will appear to be one of my men to any who see you slaying Kael's phoenix
column4: Al'ar.

column1: An Artifact From the Past^70^All^Hyjal Summit^Akama^Akama^Ruse of the Ashtongue^^^Go to the Caverns of Time in Tanaris and gain access to the Battle of Mount Hyjal. Once inside
column2: defeat Rage Winterchill and bring the Time-Phased Phylactery to Akama in Shadowmoon Valley.^Illidan's attention is now on Kael'thas
column3: thanks to you. The time has come to make our move. I've had a vision of an artifact that will aid us in our final struggle - the phylactery of a lich known as Winterchill. Unfortunately its power was lost forever after his defeat in the Battle of Mount Hyjal. There might be a way to retrieve this artifact
column4: however. Legend speaks of a place in Azeroth guarded by bronze dragons... a place where past and present meet. It is there you will find what we seek.

column1: The Hostage Soul^70^All^Shattrath City^Akama^A'dal^Ruse of the Ashtongue^^^Travel to Shattrath City to tell A'dal about Akama's request.^You might wonder why I go to such lengths to hide my intentions. Why not throw my lot in openly with the naaru? My very essence - my soul - is held prisoner inside the Black Temple. Illidan could destroy me any moment... until now! This phylactery will allow me to regain control of my soul. The time has come
column2: <name>. I'll lead Maiev and my Deathsworn to Illidan's doorstep. Speak to A'dal and and tell him of our plan. If we strike together we'll break through Illidan's defenses.

column1: Entry Into the Black Temple^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^A'dal^Xi'ri^Ruse of the Ashtongue^^A Distraction for Akama^Travel to the entrance to the Black Temple in Shadowmoon Valley and speak to Xi'ri.^<A'dal shows you an image of a naaru outside of the Black Temple
column2: fighting alongside draenei vindicators and blood elf magisters. You immediately understand that this is the distraction Akama is waiting for.>

column1: Morthis Whisperwing^70^All^Druid^Loganaar^Morthis Whisperwing^Morthis Whisperwing^^^Seek out Morthis Whisperwing at the Cenarion Refuge in Zangarmarsh.^Before all of the druidic orders coalesced into the Cenarion Circle
column2: the Druids of the Talon were responsible for teaching promising young druids the mysteries of flight. With the dissolution of the order
column3: former members teach the skill sparingly. Even now
column4: Morthis Whisperwing continues his search for a suitable apprentice. Few druids have truly mastered all the forms available to them
column5: but you show the promise Morthis requires of his students. Seek him out at the Cenarion Refuge in Zangarmarsh.

column1: Redemption of the Ashtongue^70^All^Ashtongue Deathsworn^Seer Kanai^Seer Kanai^A Distraction for Akama^^^Help Akama wrest control back of his soul by defeating the Shade of Akama inside the Black Temple. Return to Seer Kanai when you've completed this task.^When Illidan obtained the Broken's allegiance
column2: Akama was our wisest. He knew that openly opposing the Betrayer would lead to the extinction of our race. Instead he has plotted and schemed for this very moment under utmost secrecy. Failure would be catastrophic... not just for Akama
column3: not just for the Broken
column4: but for all of Outland. No one this close to Illidan has ever been able to deliver such a terrible blow to him. Help Akama free his soul and he will grant you access to Illidan's sanctum.

column1: Seek Out the Ashtongue^70^All^Ashtongue Deathsworn^Xi'ri^Seer Kanai^A Distraction for Akama^^^Find Akama's Deathsworn inside the Black Temple.^<As you look up at Xi'ri
column2: your mind becomes focused and your will determined. Your work here is not done; you must go inside the Black Temple and find Akama's followers.> <Much depends on Akama's success.>

column1: The Fall of the Betrayer^70^All^Ashtongue Deathsworn^Seer Kanai^Seer Kanai^A Distraction for Akama^^^Seer Kanai wants you to defeat Illidan inside the Black Temple.^With Illidan's lieutenants defeated
column2: Akama will be able to force open the doors to Illidan's sanctum. Be ready to bring your force inside as soon as Akama does. We still do not know what has become of Maiev
column3: but we must make our move without her. I hope your force is up to the task. Illidan will not be pleased to see Akama.

column1: The Ward of Wakening^70^All^Druid^Morthis Whisperwing^Morthis Whisperwing^Morthis Whisperwing^^Waking the Sleeper^Bring 10 Bogblossoms
column2: 10 Ancient Lichen
column3: and 10 Dreaming Glory to Morthis Whisperwing at the Cenarion Refuge.^Long ago
column4: the relics used to teach the ways of the stormcrow were entrusted to an ancient druid. Your training requires these relics
column5: so we must wake their guardian from his slumber. I will prepare a potion you can use to ease the process. The mixture requires common herbs
column6: as well as bogblossom
column7: which usually grows atop the tallest mushrooms in the marsh. Fly up there and pursue them but take care
column8: as they're quite fragile and may explode violently if mishandled.

column1: Waking the Sleeper^70^All^Druid^Morthis Whisperwing^Clintar Dreamwalker^^The Ward of Wakening^No Mere Dream^Use the Ward of Waking to help Clintar Dreamwalker emerge from the Emerald Dream. When he is conscious
column2: speak to him.^Take the ward with you and travel to Moonglade
column3: to the Stormrage Barrow Dens. Within the southernmost of the Stormrage Barrow Dens
column4: watched over by the dreamwardens
column5: you will find Clintar Dreamwalker. Administer the potion and watch over him while he wakes. He'll be extremely vulnerable as his spirit reunites with his body and he certainly won't recognize you. Declare yourself to him as soon as he comes around
column6: <name>. He will need your help to gather the relics for the ceremony.

column1: No Mere Dream^70^All^Druid^Clintar Dreamwalker^Dreamwarden Lurosa^No Mere Dream^Waking the Sleeper^^Protect Clintar Dreamwalker's Spirit while it gathers the relics of Aviana
column2: then speak to Dreamwarden Lurosa.^<Clintar listens as you relay Morthis' instructions
column3: nodding
column4: but clearly fearful.> I cannot extricate myself fully from the Emerald Dream to help you
column5: but a fragment of my spirit will guide you in your search for the relics. Guard it well
column6: <race>
column7: for it is a fragile thing. The Emerald Dream itself has become an alien
column8: dangerous place. Its grasp on me is strong
column9: and I will not be whole until the Emerald Dream returns to normalcy. What you see around you is but an echo of the reality inside the dream!

column1: Seek Out Ameer^70^All^Netherstorm^Protectorate Advisor Rahim^Commander Ameer^Seek Out Ameer^^^Seek out Commander Ameer at the Protectorate Watch Post.^It would seem that an outside force has taken an interest in the business practices of the Consortium. Five Consortium dealers have gone missing in the past two days. We have reason to believe the Ethereum are involved. If you are interested in assisting
column2: seek out Commander Ameer at the Protectorate Watch Post. You will find the Protectorate Watch Post directly east of here on the next island.

column1: A Mission of Mercy^70^All^Netherstorm^Commander Ameer^Commander Ameer^Seek Out Ameer^^Ethereum Secrets^Recover the Salvaged Ethereum Prison Key for Commander Ameer at the Protectorate Watch Post in Netherstorm.^We salvaged this prison orb on our last scouting mission into Ethereum territory. We'd have never found it had it not been for the distress signal that it was faintly emitting. We think one of our own might be locked up in there but we have no way of opening the orb up without harming whatever is inside. What we know about the Ethereum is that any of their members could - at any given time - be carrying a key to unlock an orb. Retrieve one and return so that we may uncover the mysteries of this orb.
Ethereum Secrets^70^All^Netherstorm^Commander Ameer^Commander Ameer^^A Mission of Mercy^Ethereum Prisoner I.D. Catalogue
column2: A Thousand Worlds^Commander Ameer at the Protectorate Watch Post in Netherstorm wants you to bring him an Ethereum Prisoner I.D. Tag.^<Ameer holds up a tag.> I found this prisoner I.D. tag with the remains of the fallen vanguard. I can only assume that all of their prisoners are tagged in the same manner. I'm going to start cataloguing the tags in hopes of making sense of their penal system. If in your adventures you find more Ethereum prison keys
column3: you can use them to open the Ethereum prisons at the Ethereum Staging Grounds - directly south of here. Bring me back any and all I.D. tags that you find.

column1: A Thousand Worlds^70^All^Netherstorm^Commander Ameer^Commander Ameer^A Thousand Worlds^Ethereum Secrets^^Commander Ameer at the Protectorate Watch Post in Netherstorm wants you to bring him 5 Ethereum Prison Keys.^I have cracked the code! Each tag is broken up into several segments. The front side of the tag is always the same and states: "A Thousand Worlds..." I am unsure as to the meaning of this phrase but it sounds insidious. On the back side of the tag are the vital statistics. The first set of runes indicates location and the second indicates prisoner type. Furthermore
column2: it would seem that the keys can be combined to form a special key that accesses another prison type. Now I just need more keys...

column1: Stasis Chambers of Bash'ir^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Commander Ameer^Image of Commander Ameer^A Thousand Worlds^^Purging the Chambers of Bash'ir
column2: The Mark of the Nexus-King^Use the Ethereum Key Tablet - Alpha to open Stasis Chamber Alpha at Bash'ir's Landing in Blade's Edge Mountains.^The Ethereum have a settlement on the northernmost shelf of Blade's Edge Mountains known as Bash'ir's Landing. According to the key tablet
column3: much larger versions of the prisons are kept at Bash'ir's. It should also be noted that the Ethereum refer to those prisons as stasis chambers. The key tablet grants access to a very specific stasis chamber at the landing known as Stasis Chamber Alpha. Take the key and investigate. My image will be awaiting your return at Bash'ir's Landing. Speak to me there.

column1: The Mark of the Nexus-King^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Image of Commander Ameer^Image of Commander Ameer^The Mark of the Nexus-King^Stasis Chambers of Bash'ir^^The Image of Commander Ameer at Bash'ir's Landing in the Blade's Edge Mountains wants you to bring him a Mark of the Nexus-King.^What I must now know is what the Ethereum have held inside the Mana-Tombs of Auchindoun. In your battles against the beasts of the stasis chambers of Bash'ir you may run across an item known as the Mark of the Nexus-King. Should you find such an item
column2: return it to me immediately! It is the final piece in crafting a key that will allow access to the stasis chamber inside the Mana-Tombs.

column1: Stasis Chambers of the Mana-Tombs^70^All^Mana-Tombs^Image of Commander Ameer^Image of Commander Ameer^The Mark of the Nexus-King^^Nexus-Prince Shaffar's Personal Chamber
column2: The Eye of Haramad^The Image of Commander Ameer at Bash'ir's Landing in the Blade's Edge Mountains wants you to use the Mana-Tombs Stasis Chamber Key on the Stasis Chamber inside the Mana-Tombs of Auchindoun.^The Mark of the Nexus-King that you recovered has allowed me to forge a new key for the stasis chambers found inside the Mana-Tombs. According to the glyphs on the mark
column3: two exist: one near the front and one near Nexus-Prince Shaffar. This key that I am about to give you will open the stasis chamber near the front. I want you to go to the Mana-Tombs of Auchindoun and open the Mana-Tombs Stasis Chamber.

column1: Return to Morthis Whisperwing^70^All^Druid^Dreamwarden Lurosa^Morthis Whisperwing^No Mere Dream^^^Bring the Relics of Aviana to Morthis Whisperwing at Cenarion Refuge in Zangarmarsh.^Now that the relics have been recovered
column2: you must leave this place with all haste. Clintar risked his safety and that of the dreamwardens to help you
column3: <name>
column4: but now he must fully devote his attention to fighting the force that has invaded the Emerald Dream. Take the relics back to Morthis Whisperwing
column5: along with word of what you've seen here. He may be able to help us identify just what Clintar is struggling against.

column1: To the Evergrove^70^All^Druid^Morthis Whisperwing^Arthorn Windsong^No Mere Dream^^^Speak with Arthorn Windsong at the Evergrove in Blade's Edge Mountains.^Are you certain you saw a raven in the barrow den? This is a troubling development. There's little we can do to help Clintar and the dreamwardens directly
column2: but if we can learn more about what's threatening the Emerald Dream
column3: we may be able to stop it. We've been learning about the resurgence in an ancient arakkoa cult in Blade's Edge -- one that venerates a raven god. Go to the Evergrove and find Arthorn Windsong. There may be a connection between what's happening there and in the Emerald Dream!

column1: The Book of the Raven^70^All^Druid^Arthorn Windsong^Arthorn Windsong^No Mere Dream^^^Use an Aether Ray Eye with your Seer's Stone to reveal the raven cult ghosts. Search the Vortex Pinnacle for the spirit of Sai'kkal the Elder and question him about the book of the raven
column2: then return to Arthorn Windsong.^From what you've told me
column3: Morthis's suspicions seem plausible
column4: but we need confirmation. In his research
column5: Timeon has uncovered clues that a "book of the raven" served as an ancient scripture to the cult. The arakkoa spirits will not reveal themselves to your eyes. Take this stone with you to the high peaks in the western part of Blade's Edge
column6: to the south of Raven's Wood
column7: obtain an aether ray eye
column8: and combine them to augment your sight. Search for the ghost Timeon identified as Sai'kkal the Elder.

column1: Mog'dorg the Wizened^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Grok^Mog'dorg the Wizened^Speak with the Ogre^^^Visit Mog'dorg the Wizened atop one of the towers just outside the Circle of Blood in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^Mog'dorg wise! Him send Grok to city
column2: look for help. Bloodmaul clan need help. Mog'dorg say
column3: send powerful little ones to him at Blade's Edge Mountains. Him stand on tower at Circle of Blood. Mog'dorg wise!

column1: Speak with the Ogre^70^All^Shattrath City^V'eru^Grok^Speak with the Ogre^^^Speak with the Ogre
column2: Grok
column3: in the Lower City section of Shattrath City.^<V'eru's voice fills your mind with crystalline tone and clarity.> There is an ogre down in the Lower City
column4: pleading for the assistance of passersby. They have all turned a deaf ear upon his plight. Do you think you might aid him? His name is Grok
column5: and he is sitting near the merchants to the southeast. Thank you
column6: <name>.

column1: A Distraction for Akama^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Xi'ri^Xi'ri^A Distraction for Akama^Entry Into the Black Temple^^Ensure that Akama and Maiev enter the Black Temple in Shadowmoon Valley after Xi'ri's forces create a distraction.^<Xi'ri pulses with lights as the Aldor and Scryer forces around him respond to his orders. Xi'ri's army is ready to push Illidan's forces back and create a distraction for Akama. The naaru awaits your request to begin the attack.>
Eyes in the Sky^70^All^Druid^Arthorn Windsong^Watcher Elaira^No Mere Dream^^^Speak with Watcher Elaira at the Twilight Ridge in Nagrand.^Locating the pieces of the Book of the Raven
column2: if they survive at all
column3: is going to be difficult. Our best hope is to use a keener pair of eyes than your own. Down in western Nagrand
column4: on the eastern lip of the Twilight Ridge
column5: Watcher Elaira studies the various bird species that make their home there. Visit her and see if she can help you harness avian sight to gather the pieces of the Book of the Raven.

column1: To Catch A Sparrowhawk^70^All^Druid^Watcher Elaira^Watcher Elaira^No Mere Dream^^The Raven Stones^Use the Sparrowhawk Net to capture a Wild Sparrowhawk and bring it to Watcher Elaira on the Twilight Ridge.^The wild sparrowhawks of Nagrand have the keenest sight of all the predatory birds here. But
column2: because of their size
column3: they've been pushed out of most areas by the larger windrocs. Most of the sparrowhawks nest here
column4: on the Twilight Ridge. If you can catch one
column5: I'll train it to spot the pieces of your buried tablet. It's going to be difficult
column6: though. The sparrowhawks are very skittish and will flee at your approach. I'd suggest cornering one or prowling to get close enough to cast your net.

column1: The Raven Stones^70^All^Druid^Watcher Elaira^Arthorn Windsong^^To Catch A Sparrowhawk^The Eagle's Essence^Gather 8 Raven Stones from Skettis and bring them to Arthorn Windsong at Evergrove in Blade's Edge Mountains.^I've trained your sparrowhawk to respond to a specific whistle. When it hears the sound
column2: the bird will fly to you and guide you to the location of the nearest tablet fragment. Arthorn sent word that the fragments you're looking for are buried in the Skettis area of southeastern Terokkar Forest
column3: so the bird will wait for you there. When you've gathered all the stones
column4: return the whistle to Arthorn and she will see to the animal's care and release. Convey my greetings to Arthorn when you see her.

column1: Mog'dorg the Wizened^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Chort^Mog'dorg the Wizened^^^^Speak with Mog'dorg the Wizened atop the tower where Chort is standing
column2: just outside the Circle of Blood in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^Mog'dorg the Wizened waits for you at top of da tower. He tells me to look for a <race> <class> just like you. You go speak with him about smart things. Go now
column3: but don't tell no one. It's a secret!

column1: The Eagle's Essence^70^All^Druid^Arthorn Windsong^Arthorn's Sparrowhawk^The Eagle's Essence^The Raven Stones^^Defeat the Guardian of the Eagle and obtain the Essence of the Eagle. Use Arthorn's Sparrowhawk Whistle to call Arthorn's Sparrowhawk to relay news of your success.^The Book of the Raven tells us the raven's followers captured and bound the spirits of his rivals within stone shrines. A guardian was set to watch over each
column2: lest the raven's enemies attempt to free them. The first of the shrines is the eagle's
column3: found in the hills to the south of Lake Jorune and west of Stonebreaker Hold in Terokkar Forest. The tablet says that the eagle fought valiantly
column4: but was overcome by a swarm of enemies. The armor and endurance of your bear form is well-suited to this fight.

column1: The Falcon's Essence^70^All^Druid^Arthorn's Sparrowhawk^Arthorn's Sparrowhawk^The Eagle's Essence^^^Defeat the Guardian of the Falcon
column2: obtain the Essence of the Falcon. Use Arthorn's Sparrowhawk Whistle to call Arthorn's Sparrowhawk to relay news of your success.^<The bird speaks with Arthorn's voice.> The second spirit bound by the raven's followers was the falcon. It was subdued and imprisoned close to Skettis as a reminder to the raven-priests when they held power. On the shores of Lake Ere'Noru
column3: to the northwest of Skettis
column4: you'll find the falcon's shrine. To overcome the falcon's guardian
column5: you'll need to use the falcon's strengths to your advantage. Use the speed and grace of your cat form to defeat the guardian before it reaches full strength!

column1: The Hawk's Essence^70^All^Druid^Arthorn's Sparrowhawk^Arthorn Windsong^The Eagle's Essence^^^Defeat the Guardian of the Hawk and bring the Essence of the Hawk to Arthorn Windsong at the Evergrove.^<Arthorn's voice addresses you.> The last
column2: and strongest
column3: of the spirits spoken of in the Book of the Raven is that of the hawk. It was imprisoned far from Skettis
column4: in a shrine on a remote island southeast of Auchindoun. I believe this description best matches the island we know as Sorrow Wing Point. The tablet describes the hawk's guardian as nearly invulnerable to the bird's claws. Forsake physical attacks and call down the fury of the stars to defeat this foe. Do not repeat the hawk's mistake.

column1: Return to Cenarion Refuge^70^All^Druid^Arthorn Windsong^Morthis Whisperwing^The Eagle's Essence^^^Bring Arthorn's Package to Morthis Whisperwing at Cenarion Refuge.^Bring the essences to Morthis Whisperwing
column2: along with word of our findings about the raven god. Morthis will know best how to use the essences and information in drawing Anzu out into the open. Make your way to him quickly
column3: for there's no telling how long Clintar and the dreamwardens can withstand the raven's assault! <Arthorn grabs your arm before you turn to leave>. Please
column4: <name>
column5: tell Morthis how much of a help I've been to you. I fear he will not see my hand in this work!

column1: Chasing the Moonstone^70^All^Druid^Morthis Whisperwing^Morthis Whisperwing^The Eagle's Essence^^^Bring a Southfury Moonstone to Morthis Whisperwing at the Cenarion Refuge.^If the essences are combined within a rare gemstone such as a Southfury moonstone
column2: you'll be able to release them when you're prepared to challenge Anzu. The only problem is that Southfury moonstones are only found on the Azshara side of the river
column3: on the cliffs near the river's source. Tragedy befell the last night elf party that sought the stone. Their boat is still anchored in the river near where they sighted the moonstone. Keep your eyes open and approach the site by land from the Azshara side.

column1: Grulloc Has Two Skulls^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Mog'dorg the Wizened^Mog'dorg the Wizened^^^Grim(oire) Business^Collect Grulloc's Dragon Skull.^To the east
column2: at the terminus of Dragons' End
column3: is the Cursed Hollow. Therein
column4: Grulloc
column5: son of Gruul
column6: plots his dimwitted schemes. I heard that one of his possessions was stolen from him through trickery. Was that you? Unfortunate that he was not slain in the process. If we are to regain our freedom
column7: I would have you take his most prized possession
column8: a dragon skull from when he rejoiced in his father's slaying of the black dragonflight. The only way you'll get the skull is to vanquish him.

column1: Maggoc's Treasure Chest^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Mog'dorg the Wizened^Mog'dorg the Wizened^^^Grim(oire) Business^Collect Maggoc's Treasure Chest.^On the Razor Ridge
column2: above and to the southeast
column3: Maggoc patrols. His father assigned him as the warden of the eastern mountain range
column4: and he revels in terrorizing any creature that gets in his way. As a son of Gruul
column5: he must be done away with if my clan is to survive. That's where you come in. Maggoc carries a treasure chest with him at all times. Prove to me that he has been slain by bringing me his precious chest. Feel free to keep whatever you find within it.

column1: Even Gronn Have Standards^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Mog'dorg the Wizened^Mog'dorg the Wizened^^^Grim(oire) Business^Collect Slaag's Standard.^Are you familiar with Shattrath City
column2: <class>? Above it to the northwest is a place called the Barrier Hills
column3: which you can only get to upon a flying mount. One of Gruul's sons
column4: Slaag
column5: exiled himself and took control of the Gordunni ogres that reside there. Even at such a distance
column6: we cannot afford to leave him in peace
column7: lest he return when the rest of his brothers have been slain. <name>
column8: you must travel there
column9: and bring back his standard as proof that he has been dealt with.

column1: Grim(oire) Business^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Mog'dorg the Wizened^Mog'dorg the Wizened^Grim(oire) Business^Grulloc Has Two Skulls
column2: Maggoc's Treasure Chest
column3: Even Gronn Have Standards^^Collect Vim'gol's Vile Grimoire.^There is one more gronn to be slain: Skulloc Soulgrinder. He keeps himself hidden away
column4: but there is a way to coax him forth. He was trained by an ogre warlock known as Vim'gol the Vile
column5: whose grimoire you must retrieve! Vim'gol must be summoned by standing within a fire ring at his circle. Find Vim'gol's Circle in the mountains
column6: to the northeast
column7: near the Broken Wilds. <name>
column8: if you hear Vim'gol talk about growing bigger
column9: get people back into each of the five fire rings to interrupt his casting!

column1: Into the Soulgrinder^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Mog'dorg the Wizened^Mog'dorg the Wizened^Grim(oire) Business^^Ogre Heaven
column2: Speak with Mog'dorg^Collect Skulloc's Soul.^The grimoire is the key to Skulloc's downfall. Read aloud from the book at Soulgrinder's Barrow to initiate the ritual. An object known as the Soulgrinder will appear
column3: as well as Skulloc's ghostly victims
column4: who will try to destroy it. You must keep them from doing so long enough to force Skulloc fully into the world. Find the barrow by heading north through the Daggermaw Canyon on the other side of the Circle of Blood. It is on the right side before Gruul's Lair. Bring back Skulloc's soul.

column1: Vanquish the Raven God^70^All^Druid^Morthis Whisperwing^Morthis Whisperwing^The Eagle's Essence^^Eternal Vigilance^Slay the Raven God and return to Morthis Whisperwing at Cenarion Refuge.^We must waste no time in dealing with the raven god. You must take the essence-infused moonstone to a place of great power in order to lure the god from the relative safety of the Emerald Dream. Descend into the Sethekk Halls and set the moonstone in the clutches of the raven's claw. You'll find it in the chamber before the talon king's hall. Anzu must be made believe that his followers have gathered to welcome him back into the world. Once he has manifested
column2: show him no mercy!

column1: The Fall of Magtheridon^70^Alliance^Hellfire Peninsula^Magtheridon's Head^Force Commander Danath Trollbane^^^^Return Magtheridon's Head to Force Commander Danath Trollbane at Honor Hold in Hellfire Peninsula.^The source of Illidan Stormrage's fel orc army has been vanquished. The manufactory halts production of its grim product - at least for now. All that remains are a few trinkets and this severed head - a fitting trophy for a hero of the Alliance. Return Magtheridon's head to Danath Trollbane at Honor Hold.

The Fall of Magtheridon^70^Horde^Hellfire Peninsula^Magtheridon's Head^Nazgrel^^^^Return Magtheridon's Head to Nazgrel at Thrallmar in Hellfire Peninsula.^The source of Illidan Stormrage's fel orc army has been vanquished. The manufactory halts production of its grim product - at least for now. All that remains are a few trinkets and this severed head - a fitting trophy for a hero of the Horde. Return Magtheridon's head to Nazgrel at Thrallmar.
World of Shadows^70^All^Skettis^Severin^Severin^^^Secrets of the Talonpriests
column2: More Shadow Dust^Severin wants you to venture into Skettis and retrieve 6 Shadow Dusts from the arakkoa that dwell there.^Sky Commander Adaris was seriously injured during a Skettis incursion. He's been in and out of consciousness since. I fear he has succumbed to a feverish delirium. During brief lucid moments he demands that I prepare an elixir made from shadow dust carried by the arakkoa. He seems to believe it will allow him to see into a "world of shadows" where the arakkoa's true leaders dwell. I do not believe this nonsense for a second
column3: but I fear he won't rest until I obtain such an elixir. Will you help?

column1: Secrets of the Talonpriests^70^All^Skettis^Sky Commander Adaris^Sky Commander Adaris^^World of Shadows^^Obtain an Elixir of Shadows from Severin and use it to find and slay Talonpriest Ishaal
column2: Talonpriest Skizzik and Talonpriest Zellek in Skettis. Return to Commander Adaris after completing this task.^Thank you for paying heed to my fevered rants. All along we had been trying to identify and destroy the Skettis chain of command; we had learned of three clerics known as the talonpriests
column3: but we'd never seen them with our own two eyes. Now we know why. Talk to Severin to obtain more of the elixir he discovered. Use the elixir to find and kill the three talonpriests: Ishaal
column4: Skizzik and Zellek. They're rumored to dwell in Veil Ala'rak
column5: near the eastern shore of Blackwind Lake.

column1: Kael'thas and the Verdant Sphere^70^All^Tempest Keep^Verdant Sphere^A'dal^^^^Take the Verdant Sphere to A'dal in Shattrath City.^The air around you hums - a gentle hum. The naaru are aware of your victory. Perhaps they are the reason you were compelled to pick up this sphere from the still-twitching remains of Kael'thas Sunstrider. What secrets could it hold? Perhaps A'dal in Shattrath City could make sense of the item.

Fires Over Skettis^70^All^Skettis^Sky Sergeant Doryn^Sky Sergeant Doryn^^To Skettis!^^Seek out Monstrous Kaliri Eggs on the tops of Skettis dwellings and use the Skyguard Blasting Charges on them. Return to Sky Sergeant Doryn.^You think you have what it takes to be part of the Skyguard? We'll have to see how you handle yerself in the air. The arakkoa are breeding a gargantuan variety of their attack pets and are using it against our scouts. I want you to take these blasting charges and use them to destroy hatcheries above the arakkoa's dwellings. Avoid the monstrous kaliri guarding the hatcheries. They'll knock you off your mount before you know what hit you.

Ogre Heaven^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Mog'dorg the Wizened^Chu'a'lor^Speak with Mog'dorg^Into the Soulgrinder^^Speak with Chu'a'lor at Ogri'la in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^Now that you have delivered us from bondage
