column2: we can begin the process of reunifying the clans. This will take some time; old grudges are difficult to overcome. But more pressing
column3: you must go to Ogri'la in the heavens above to the west. You must defend it
column4: and us
column5: from those forces above that the gronn used to protect us from: ethereals
column6: demons
column7: and worst of all
column8: the black dragonflight. When you find ogre heaven
column9: seek out the wisdom of Chu'a'lor on how best to proceed.

column1: Bombing Run^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Sky Sergeant Vanderlip^Sky Sergeant Vanderlip^Bombing Run^Our Boy Wants To Be A Skyguard Ranger
column2: An Apexis Relic^Bomb Them Again!^Use the Skyguard Bombs to destroy 15 Fel Cannonball Stacks.^You have a flying mount... so what! You think you have what it takes to use it properly? Forge Camp: Wrath and Forge Camp: Terror
column3: to the north and south
column4: are a major pain in my backside
column5: as well as being a threat to peaceful Ogri'la. With all of those fel cannons shooting down the Skyguard left and right
column6: we can't get through there to take care of business. You want to prove yourself? Take these bombs and knock out their ammo stacks. Just don't let them shoot you down
column7: too!

column1: Eternal Vigilance^70^All^Druid^Morthis Whisperwing^Morthis Whisperwing^^Vanquish the Raven God^^Speak with Morthis Whisperwing to receive an Essence-Infused Moonstone.^Your defeat of Anzu
column2: the raven god
column3: is truly a remarkable accomplishment. He may not abandon his quest to return to Outland
column4: I fear. As long as he has followers here
column5: he will attempt to rise again. Keep the essence-infused moonstone with you in case we have not heard the last of Anzu.

column1: In Service of the Illidari^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Mordenai^Overlord Mor'ghor^In Service of the Illidari^Blood Oath of the Netherwing^^Travel to Netherwing Ledge and deliver the Illidari Service Papers to Overlord Mor'ghor at Dragonmaw Base Camp.^Netherwing Ledge... What was once a bastion of sanctuary for the Netherwing is now home to the Dragonmaw. While the orcs may have control of our territory
column2: our magic there is still strong. Strong enough to cloak your true identity and allow you to infiltrate the ranks of Dragonmaw. I have prepared this letter for you to present to their leader
column3: Overlord Mor'ghor. Fly headlong into the maw of our enemy and seek out Dragonmaw Base Camp to start your new life as a fel orc of Illidan Stormrage.

column1: Enter the Taskmaster^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Overlord Mor'ghor^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath^In Service of the Illidari^^Netherwing Crystals
column2: Nethermine Flayer Hide
column3: Netherdust Pollen
column4: Nethercite Ore
column5: Your Friend On The Inside
column6: A Job Unfinished...^Speak with Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath at Dragonmaw Base Camp.^<Mor'ghor crumples up the service letter and tosses it aside.> Alright grunt
column7: first things first. If you're gonna join my beloved Dragonmaw army
column8: you'll need to work. Everyone works up here on the ledge. Get a job and don't screw it up and I'll see if there might be something more interesting for you to do later. Go talk to Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath. He's standin' in the middle of town. He'll assess your skills and assign work as he sees fit. Now get out of my face!

column1: Netherwing Crystals^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath^^Enter the Taskmaster^^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath at Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to bring him 30 Netherwing Crystals.^No good at nothin'? That's fine. Even lunkheads like you can be used around here. Just find creatures on the ledge and kill 'em. Sometimes they'll have nether crystals on their carcasses. Gather those and bring 'em back to me and I'll consider your work order for the day complete.

Nethermine Flayer Hide^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath^^Enter the Taskmaster^^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath at Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to bring him 35 Nethermine Flayer Hides.^A skinner
column2: eh? Well you'll find plenty to skin here! You gotta search for flayers around crystal formations. Take 'em down and take their hides. Sometimes they'll have a hide worth keepin'. Bring those to me.

column1: Netherdust Pollen^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath^^Enter the Taskmaster^^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath at Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to bring him 40 Netherdust Pollen.^A flower picker?! Hilarious... Unfortunately
column2: our mages and shaman need your services. The netherdust bushes that grow on this ledge have special pollen that is apparently very useful in their magical dealings. Bring me that stuff and I'll consider your work order complete.

column1: Nethercite Ore^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath^^Enter the Taskmaster^^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath at Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to bring him 40 Nethercite Ore.^A miner! <Varkule salutes.> An orc after my own heart! That's how Varkule got his start - minin'! There ain't nothin' better than getting down and dirty in the mines
column2: is there? Now get out there and find those nethercite deposits. Strip 'em for all their worth and bring me back the ore.

column1: A Slow Death^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Yarzill the Merc^Yarzill the Merc^^Your Friend On The Inside^^Yarzill the Merc at Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to use Yarzill's Mutton in conjunction with Fel Glands to poison 12 Dragonmaw Peon Camps.^The Dragonmaw have peons stationed at nearly every crystal formation up here. While the outright slaying of them would draw far too much unwanted attention to you
column2: there is a way that we can thin their numbers and remain below the suspicious eyes of Mor'ghor. Venture into the wilds of Shadowmoon Valley and slay the tainted wildlife. Take from them their corrupt fel glands. Use those fel glands with this mutton that I'll give you near the peons. They'll take one bite and fall deathly ill!

column1: Ishaal's Almanac^70^All^Skettis^Ishaal's Almanac^Sky Commander Adaris^Ishaal's Almanac^^^Bring Ishaal's Almanac to Sky Commander Adaris north of Skettis.^This mysterious tome was on Talonpriest Ishaal's body. It contains arcane symbols and charts of celestial bodies beyond your comprehension. All writing is in a language you don't understand; likely an ancient version of the arakkoa written tongue. Perhaps you should bring this to Sky Commander Adaris.

Speak with Mog'dorg^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Bladespire Supplicant^Mog'dorg the Wizened^Speak with Mog'dorg^Into the Soulgrinder^^Speak with Mog'dorg the Wizened. He stands atop the tower on the east side of the Circle of Blood in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^<King /Queen> <name>! You speak with Mog'dorg the Wizened before you leave and go to Ogri'la!

Bomb Them Again!^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Sky Sergeant Vanderlip^Sky Sergeant Vanderlip^Bombing Run^^^Use the Skyguard Bombs to destroy 15 Fel Cannonball Stacks.^We're still having problems with those flak cannons
column2: <name>. Don't get me wrong -- I think that you did an outstanding job the last time out -- but
column3: that doesn't change the fact that those damned demons seem to be replenishing their ammo supplies faster than we can knock them out. And that means we're having a hell of a time getting our people through there
column4: not to mention the risk those demons pose to Ogri'la. What do you say? Want to take another shot at it?

column1: An Ally in Lower City^70^All^Shattrath City^Sky Commander Adaris^Rilak the Redeemed^Ishaal's Almanac^^^Bring Ishaal's Almanac to Rilak the Redeemed in the Lower City section of Shattrath City.^There is an arakkoa in Lower City by the name of Rilak... He can be trusted. Take the book... to him. <Adaris drifts into unconsciousness as he returns the book to you.>
The Crystals^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Chu'a'lor^Chu'a'lor^The Crystals^^Guardian of the Monument
column2: Wrangle Some Aether Rays!^Collect 5 Apexis Shards.^When prepared correctly
column3: the crystals of the mountains exhibit strange powers
column4: such as the clarity of mind that we have found here in Ogri'la. All of the creatures atop the mountains covet the crystal shards and use them to further their own goals. An economy has even sprung up around them. To assist us
column5: you must first learn about the Apexis shards. Bring me some. In addition to the creatures here having them
column6: they can sometimes be found where the flayers dig at the larger crystals.

column1: Banish the Demons^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Kronk^Kronk^^^Banish More Demons^Use the Banishing Crystal to banish 15 demons at Forge Camp: Wrath or Forge Camp: Terror.^You've arrived at the perfect time
column2: friend! We are in need of assistance. In return
column3: you will receive something very rare
column4: which will help us both in the end. We're not a violent ogre any longer
column5: but the demons nearby threaten to overrun us and the Skyguard. The problem with demons is that
column6: once killed
column7: they come right back in new bodies! But
column8: if you use this crystal to summon a banishing portal
column9: when they die near it
column10: their essences will be drawn in and banished back from whence they came!

column1: Countdown to Doom^70^All^Skettis^Rilak the Redeemed^Sky Commander Adaris^Ishaal's Almanac^^Hazzik's Bargain^Return to Sky Commander Adaris at Blackwind Landing in Terokkar Forest with the news about Terokk's return.^This almanac presages the return of Terokk
column2: the most powerful and terrible Skettis king in arakkoa history. I always believed this to be the mere legend
column3: <name>. The return of the talonpriests and your recovery of this tome indicate otherwise. With each day
column4: Terokk comes closer to returning to full strength. Your only chance is to bring him to our world prematurely. Return to Skettis and speak to Adaris about this. Let us hope he has the wisdom to do the right thing.

column1: A Shabby Disguise^70^All^Skettis^Hazzik^Hazzik^Hazzik's Bargain^^Adversarial Blood^Use the Shabby Arakkoa Disguise to obtain the Adversarial Bloodlines from Sahaak and return to Hazzik.^Open the package
column2: <name>. It is a disguise. It doesn't look very convincing
column3: does it? I craft them for ethereal smugglers in search of rare books. There is an arakkoa scribe who dwells in the central island in Skettis
column4: Terokk's Rest; his name is Sahaak. He is old and nearly blind. Use the disguise to speak with him and obtain the book known as the Adversarial Bloodlines. Be careful
column5: <name>. The disguise won't fool the other arakkoa.

column1: Our Boy Wants To Be A Skyguard Ranger^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Torkus^Torkus^Our Boy Wants To Be A Skyguard Ranger^^Bombing Run
column2: The Skyguard Outpost^Collect an Unstable Flask of the Beast.^<class>
column3: we've got a problem -- we have lots of sons. And ever since the Skyguard moved in nearby
column4: all our sons ever talk about is joining their ranks. As a proud father
column5: we want them to have every advantage for when they apply. So
column6: would you go to the fel crystalforge at either forge camp to the north or south
column7: and procure a magic flask for our sons? You can't miss their green smoke. We think that they take ten apexis shards to make. We'd give you the shards
column8: but we don't have any at the moment.

column1: The Not-So-Friendly Skies...^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Yarzill the Merc^Yarzill the Merc^^Your Friend On The Inside^^Yarzill the Merc at Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to recover 10 Netherwing Relics.^On the northeast edge of this island exists a dock used for the packaging and transport of Netherwing crystals and relics. Dragonmaw Transporters transport the goods from the dock to Dragonmaw Fortress while Dragonmaw Ascendants guard the ground from any would-be attackers. This leaves one opening for you to make a strike at the Dragonmaw: The Dragonmaw Skyway. Fly to the shattered islands of the Dragonmaw Skyway and ambush the transporters that use the route. Recover our stolen relics!

Out of This World Produce!^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Old Orok^Rocket-Chief Fuselage^Out of This World Produce!^^^Bring the Preserved Fruit to Rocket-Chief Fuselage at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^I'll be the first to admit I'm not quite sure what this order is for
column2: but Rocket-Chief Fuselage's instructions were very specific -- only the very best fruit
column3: preserved to survive a long voyage and sealed against the elements. There were other specifications
column4: zero-gravity this and low pressure that. I don't pretend to understand it
column5: but the price is right
column6: so he'll get his superfood. Bring this crate to him up at Area 52. After crossing into Netherstorm
column7: keep following the road until you see the town.

column1: A Strange Vision^67^Horde^Nagrand^Seer Nakha^Rocket-Chief Fuselage^A Strange Vision^^^Speak with Rocket-Chief Fuselage at Area 52.^I've had a most unusual vision
column2: <name>
column3: and I don't know quite what to make of it. I've seen an arrow
column4: an immense arrow
column5: riding into the sky on a trail of fire. Such a feat is trivial for a skilled mage
column6: but somehow I know the arrow I saw is not the product of magic. It will be unlike anything the people of Azeroth have ever achieved. You must seek out the people working on this
column7: <name>. Lend them your help
column8: for without it
column9: their efforts may yet fail.

column1: Assist Exarch Orelis^67^All^Shattrath City^Vindicator Aeus^Exarch Orelis^Assist Exarch Orelis^^^Speak with Exarch Orelis at Area 52.^Not long ago
column2: High Priestess Ishanah sent a small group of anchorites to Netherstorm
column3: under the command of Exarch Orelis. They were to investigate the activities of Kael'thas and his minions
column4: but we haven't received any reports of their findings yet. I worry that our presence in the area might not be strong enough to carry out the mission. I'm certain that the exarch could benefit from your knowledge and experience. Are you willing to travel to Area 52 and assist him?

column1: Report to Spymaster Thalodien^67^All^Shattrath City^Arcanist Savan^Spymaster Thalodien^Report to Spymaster Thalodien^^^Report to Spymaster Thalodien at Area 52.^Some time ago
column2: Voren'thal dispatched a small team to Netherstorm to investigate the activities of Kael'thas. Our leader has the utmost confidence in Spymaster Thalodien and his compatriots
column3: and has decided to honor his request for reinforcements. Thalodien's report was brief
column4: but clear that he's encountered something of great importance. Report to him at Area 52 and assist him in any way possible
column5: <name>.

column1: Parts for the Rocket-Chief^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Bossi Pentapiston^Rocket-Chief Fuselage^Parts for the Rocket-Chief^^^Bring Bossi's Spare Parts to Rocket-Chief Fuselage at Area 52 in the Netherstorm.^You can count on one hand the number of times I've collaborated with a goblin. We're far more likely to be in competition with them
column2: but when I received Rocket-Chief Fuselage's request
column3: I just couldn't refuse him. This crate is full of parts I'm not using here
column4: but that the rocket-chief might be able to put to use on his project. Would you be kind enough to deliver them if you're on your way to Area 52? Who knows
column5: maybe some fine gnomish parts could keep his creation from exploding!

column1: A Job Unfinished...^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Partially Digested Hand^Overlord Mor'ghor^^Enter the Taskmaster^^Slay 10 Overmine Flayers and Barash the Den Mother. Return to Overlord Mor'ghor at the Dragonmaw Base Camp should you succeed.^In the name of our great master... For the glory of Illidan! By order of Overlord Mor'ghor
column2: the great plateau of Netherwing Ledge is to be secured. With all Netherwing drakes captured or forced off of the land
column3: rock flayers are running rampant and threatening crystal harvesting operations. Destroy them all
column4: their den mother and her consort
column5: Arvoar. Mor'ghor commands it! <It would appear that this orc failed to take the plateau. It is time to prove your worth to Mor'ghor!>

column1: A Mystifying Vision^67^Alliance^Nagrand^Seer Jovar^Rocket-Chief Fuselage^A Mystifying Vision^^^Speak with Rocket-Chief Fuselage at Area 52.^A strange vision haunts me
column2: <name>. I see a continuous cloud of smoke ascending toward the sky
column3: left in the wake of a giant fire moving ever faster away. It is not a natural phenomenon
column4: nor a creation of evil; that much I know. I have no knowledge of what it looks like
column5: save that it is the product of the labor of many. Yet
column6: without more hands
column7: it may never come to be. Travel to Netherstorm
column8: <class>. Locate those responsible for this creation and offer them your aid.

column1: Building a Better Gryphon^67^Alliance^Blade's Edge Mountains^Rip Pedalslam^Brunn Flamebeard^^^^Speak with Brunn Flamebeard at Wildhammer Stronghold in Shadowmoon Valley.^I've heard that the Wildhammer dwarves maintain a gryphon roost at their fortress down in southern Shadowmoon Valley. If you're going down there
column2: would you speak to them on my behalf? I have some ideas on how to improve their gryphons! Why stop at armoring them when you could attach an altimeter
column3: a rear view mirror
column4: and rocket? Imagine how fast you could go with one of those babies strapped to your gryphon's back! I'll call it the TurboGryphon 8000!

column1: Visions of Destruction^67^Alliance^Nagrand^Seer Jovar^Wing Commander Nuainn^Visions of Destruction^^^Speak with Wing Commander Nuainn at Wildhammer Stronghold.^A vision of cataclysm often disturbs my rest -- a rain of green fire falling to the earth
column2: felling the valiant defenders of a mighty fortress. It has haunted me for weeks now
column3: although I have only recently come to understand its meaning. To the far east
column4: in Shadowmoon Valley
column5: the Wildhammer dwarves endure constant attacks from the Burning Legion and numerous other foes. They fight bravely
column6: but without relief
column7: their enemies will triumph. Go to their side
column8: <name>. Help them in their fight.

column1: Zorus the Judicator^67^Alliance^Shattrath City^Fantei^Zorus the Judicator^Zorus the Judicator^^^Speak with Zorus the Judicator at Wildhammer Stronghold.^The history of Shadowmoon Valley is a long and troubled one. Few delve into it for fear of breathing new life into the unspeakable atrocities that took place there. Not all are so timid
column2: though. Zorus the Judicator searches for the truth about the ghosts of Shadowmoon's past. It is a staggering undertaking
column3: one with which he would welcome help
column4: I'm sure. If you should venture into the valley
column5: look for Zorus at Wildhammer Stronghold
column6: in the central portion of the valley's southern region.

column1: Chief Apothecary Hildagard^67^Horde^Shattrath City^Fantei^Chief Apothecary Hildagard^Chief Apothecary Hildagard^^^Speak with Chief Apothecary Hildagard at Shadowmoon Village.^The history of Shadowmoon Valley is a long and troubled one. Few study it for fear of breathing new life into the unspeakable atrocities that took place there. Not all are so timid
column2: though. Chief Apothecary Hildagard's research delves into the ghosts of Shadowmoon's past. It is a staggering undertaking
column3: one with which she would welcome help
column4: I'm sure. If your travels bring you there
column5: seek Hildagard at Shadowmoon Village
column6: in the northwestern reaches of the valley.

column1: The Apprentice's Request^67^Horde^Blade's Edge Mountains^Agadai^Dama Wildmane^^^^Speak with Dama Wildmane at Shadowmoon Village in Shadowmoon Valley.^As an apprentice wind rider master
column2: one of my tasks is to care for the beasts when they're not flying. The problem is that we have so few here
column3: there's very little downtime for any of them. I'm afraid we'll work them all to death if we don't receive any replacements. There's a large stable down in Shadowmoon Village
column4: in western Shadowmoon Valley. Dama Wildmane oversees the wind rider care and training there. Would you speak with her on our behalf and let her know about our situation?

column1: Kroghan's Report^67^Horde^Nagrand^Captain Kroghan^Blood Guard Gulmok^Kroghan's Report^^^Speak with Blood Guard Gulmok at Shadowmoon Village.^My original orders were to remain in Garadar for a short time
column2: then continue on and report to Blood Guard Gulmok at Shadowmoon Village. What I've seen in my time here is that Garadar could benefit from a long term Horde liaison. I know that Blood Guard Gulmok needs all the troops he can get
column3: but I know he'll understand that my mission here isn't yet complete. Travel to Shadowmoon Village
column4: in northwestern Shadowmoon Valley
column5: and inform Blood Guard Gulmok of my delayed arrival.

column1: The Great Netherwing Egg Hunt^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Yarzill the Merc^Yarzill the Merc^^Your Friend On The Inside^Accepting All Eggs^Yarzill the Merc at Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to recover a Netherwing Egg.^Should you discover any Netherwing eggs while exploring
column2: bring them to me. Be warned
column3: a Netherwing egg is a rare discovery. Do not become frustrated if you cannot locate one. These Dragonmaw have been very thorough in collecting most of them and shipping them off to parts unknown. Eggs might be found on creatures of the island
column4: near crystal formations
column5: in the mines
column6: or even inside a nethercite node or netherdust bush. Keep a low profile. We don't need Mor'ghor catching wind of your actions.

column1: Banish More Demons^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Kronk^Kronk^^Banish the Demons^^Use the Banishing Crystal to banish 15 demons at Forge Camp: Wrath or Forge Camp: Terror.^If we know the demons
column2: and we do because we've studied them extensively
column3: they're fast at work repairing any damage that has been done to their precious transporter. So
column4: if you want a chance at another darkrune
column5: take our banishing crystal back out there and eliminate more demons. Besides
column6: you want to help us to lessen the threat that the demons pose
column7: yes? We said "chance" because the process we use yields mixed results. You might get a darkrune
column8: or you might get something else entirely.

column1: Rise
column2: Overseer!^70^ ^Shadowmoon Valley^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath^Overlord Mor'ghor^^Your Friend On The Inside^Overseeing and You: Making the Right Cho
column3: The Netherwing Mines
column4: Stand Tall
column5: Captain!^Speak with Overlord Mor'ghor at Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley.^Rare it is that a peon survives for as long as you have. Rarer still is when a peon rises from the dregs to attain a new rank. <Varkule claps.> The Overlord has called for you
column6: grunt. A new rank awaits
column7: no doubt.

column1: Overseeing and You: Making the Right Choices^70^ ^Shadowmoon Valley^Chief Overseer Mudlump^Chief Overseer Mudlump^Overseeing and You: Making the Right Choices^Rise
column2: Overseer!^^Chief Overseer Mudlump at the Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to bring him 10 pieces of Knothide Leather and 1 Hardened Hide of Tyrantus.^So you're the new overseer
column3: eh? Well there's one thing any good overseer needs and that's the proper disciplinary weapon. Before you can go out there and knock some sense into these peons you need to have your "piece." Each overseer has to gather the materials required to make their own "piece" and you'll be no different. I'll need knothide leather and the hardened hide of Tyrantus. You'll find Tyrantus in Eco-Dome Farfield
column4: located in the northern reaches of Netherstorm.

column1: The Booterang: A Cure For The Common Worthless Peon^70^ ^Shadowmoon Valley^Chief Overseer Mudlump^Chief Overseer Mudlump^Overseeing and You: Making the Right Cho^^^Chief Overseer Mudlump at the Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to discipline 20 lazy Dragonmaw Peons. You will also need to return your Booterang.^This is your booterang. There are many like it but this one is yours. As an overseer you will use this booterang to sow terror into the hearts of defiant peons. Proper use of the booterang will instill obedience and ensure subservience. Venture forth to the crystal fields and discipline any peons that you see slacking off. Show them the might of the booterang!

Hazzik's Bargain^70^All^Skettis^Hazzik^Hazzik^Hazzik's Bargain^Countdown to Doom^^Obtain Hazzik's Package at his dwelling in eastern Skettis and return to him with it.^Do not draw attention to our conversation. Adaris would not approve. I belong to the lowest caste of arakkoa
column2: <name>. During Terokk's rule I would've been sacrificed to the dark powers worshipped by his talonpriests. If what you say is true and the talonpriests are seeking Terokk's return
column3: then you must prevent them from succeeding - regardless of what your leader says! I've something to offer you that you'll find useful. There is a package at my old dwelling in Upper Veil Shil'ak. Bring it to me!

column1: The Trouble Below^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Chu'a'lor^Mog'dorg the Wizened^^^^Speak with Mog'dorg the Wizened atop one of the towers just outside the Circle of Blood in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^We commend your zeal in wanting to help out here in Ogri'la
column2: <class>. However
column3: we have a favor to ask of you before we can accept your assistance. Down below our brethren are enslaved to the Sons of Gruul. Please
column4: speak with Mog'dorg the Wizened
column5: who is leading an ogre resistance against their gronn masters. Seek him out atop the tower on the eastern side of the Circle of Blood arena.

column1: An Apexis Relic^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Chu'a'lor^Chu'a'lor^The Crystals^^Bombing Run^Gain Apexis Vibrations from an Apexis Relic.^Long ago a now-extinct sect of the arakkoa known as the Apexis lived here. Remnants of their civilization are still present. We call them apexis relics. What we know about them is that
column2: when properly used
column3: they grant a boon. Each relic presents a colored sequence which
column4: when the crystals are pressed in the correct order
column5: leads through a series of levels
column6: each harder than the last. An apexis shard is needed to power the relic. Return when you have attained the insight of the apexis vibration.

column1: Guardian of the Monument^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Chu'a'lor^Chu'a'lor^^The Crystals^^Collect an Apexis Guardian's Head.^You've figured out how to use the single-person relics
column2: but as you may have seen
column3: there are bigger ones
column4: which they surround. These larger apexis monuments function in much the same way
column5: but they take many more apexis shards to activate and require four persons to operate. Of greater concern to us are the guardians that are summoned through their use. These crystal constructs turned on their arakkoan masters long ago
column6: and now endanger Ogri'la. We would ask that you destroy one and bring us proof.

column1: A Father's Duty^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Torkus^Torkus^Our Boy Wants To Be A Skyguard Ranger^^A Fel Whip For Gahk^Collect an Unstable Flask of the Sorcerer for him.^As to that other magical flask
column2: it can only be obtained from one spot: Bash'ir Landing. It's an ethereal base
column3: and they aren't too friendly with outsiders
column4: so it might be a little dangerous to obtain. Where's Bash'ir Landing
column5: you ask? Well
column6: if you get on your flying steed and head north by northeast
column7: well past Forge Camp: Wrath
column8: you'll eventually spot it. The Bash'ir crystalforge itself is at the northeast corner of the landing. Thank you for doing this
column9: <name>. It'll mean the world to our sons!

column1: The Skyguard Outpost^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Chu'a'lor^Sky Commander Keller^^Our Boy Wants To Be A Skyguard Ranger^^Speak with Sky Commander Keller at the Skyguard Outpost in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^<name>
column2: we were wondering if you might be willing to visit our friends just to the north at the Skyguard Outpost? Sky Commander Keller and his Skyguard are here running missions for our mutual protection
column3: and he's asked us to send along anyone that we feel would excel at helping out. That would be you! Head up there as soon as you can
column4: and please
column5: give him our regards.

column1: Dragonmaw Race: The Ballad of Oldie McOld^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Murg "Oldie" Muckjaw^Ja'y Nosliw^^Earning Your Wings...^Dragonmaw Race: Trope the Filth-Belcher^Follow Murg "Oldie" Muckjaw while attempting to stay on your flying mount. Should you defeat Murg "Oldie" Muckjaw
column2: report your victory to Ja'y Nosliw at the Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley.^Don't let the gray hair fool you
column3: grunt. I'm still ten times the rider that you are! And don't go thinking that this old dog doesn't have any tricks up his sleeve. Now all you gotta do is follow me and try not to get knocked down off your mount. If you can do that
column4: Oldie will admit defeat. We'll lift off as soon as you're ready.

column1: Wrangle Some Aether Rays!^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Skyguard Khatie^Skyguard Khatie^Wrangle Some Aether Rays!^The Crystals^To Rule The Skies^Use the Wrangling Rope to capture 5 Aether Rays.^Wanna help the Skyguard and Ogri'la? Just hear me out before you walk away
column2: <hot stuff /girly>. We're in need of remounts! The bombing runs and missions to Bash'ir Landing have taken a toll on our mounts. The aether rays that fly around Vortex Pinnacle
column3: and the Crystal Spine to the northeast
column4: look like they'd do just fine. You don't even have to bring them back here
column5: though that would be nice. Just break and rope them
column6: and we'll track them down later. Think you can wrangle me up some?

column1: Wrangle More Aether Rays!^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Skyguard Khatie^Skyguard Khatie^Wrangle Some Aether Rays!^^^Use the Wrangling Rope to capture 5 Aether Rays.^So
column2: I hope that you're up to helping us wrangle up even more aether rays! From what I can see
column3: you're a natural with the rope! And it's for a good cause
column4: because not only do we get fresh mounts
column5: but it helps us to protect Ogri'la
column6: which the ogres appreciate. Remember
column7: the aether rays fly around Vortex Pinnacle
column8: and the Crystal Spine to the northeast. Think you can wrangle me up some more?

column1: Dragonmaw Race: Trope the Filth-Belcher^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Trope the Filth-Belcher^Ja'y Nosliw^^Dragonmaw Race: The Ballad of Oldie McOl^Dragonmaw Race: Corlok the Vet^Follow Trope the Filth-Belcher while attempting to stay on your flying mount. Should you defeat Trope the Filth-Belcher
column2: report your victory to Ja'y Nosliw at the Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley.^Dragonmaw treat you right
column3: <name>. Even a worn out cursed being like me is given a chance. Now if you want to prove your worth to the Skybreakers
column4: you will have to defeat me. I'm going to shake you off my tail like a bad case of fleas... We'll lift off when you are ready.

column1: Dragonmaw Race: Corlok the Vet^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Corlok the Vet^Ja'y Nosliw^^Dragonmaw Race: Trope the Filth-Belcher^Dragonmaw Race: Wing Commander Ichman^Follow Corlok the Vet while attempting to stay on your flying mount. Should you defeat Corlok the Vet
column2: report your victory to Ja'y Nosliw at the Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley.^You are challenging ME? Don't make me laugh! You're serious? Very well then! All you need to do is not die. You can manage to not die
column3: right?? Even if I'm hurling skulls at you and flying circles around your pathetic riding skills? Just let me know when you're ready and we'll lift off.

column1: Dragonmaw Race: Wing Commander Ichman^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Wing Commander Ichman^Ja'y Nosliw^^Dragonmaw Race: Corlok the Vet^Dragonmaw Race: Wing Commander Mulverick^Follow Wing Commander Ichman while attempting to stay on your flying mount. Should you defeat Wing Commander Ichman
column2: report your victory to Ja'y Nosliw at the Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley.^Three years I spent in that hell hole. Three years a prisoner of war to the damnable Frostwolf Clan. Made to sit in their tower and listen to them endlessly whine about the bridge to Dun Baldar. About how it's "unfair" that blah
column3: blah
column4: blah
column5: blah... War isn't fair! To hell with 'em all! The minute I was freed I left that place forever and came here to start a new life. Now Mulv and I are vying for the top orc spot. If you want it
column6: you're gonna have to go through me
column7: scrub. We go when you're ready.

column1: Dragonmaw Race: Wing Commander Mulverick^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Wing Commander Mulverick^Ja'y Nosliw^^Dragonmaw Race: Wing Commander Ichman^Dragonmaw Race: Captain Skyshatter^Follow Wing Commander Mulverick while attempting to stay on your flying mount. Should you defeat Wing Commander Mulverick
column2: report your victory to Ja'y Nosliw at the Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley.^Three years of blood
column3: sweat and tears. Mostly tears... The amount of crying that a hardened soldier does when it comes down to all-out war is amazing! "They're jumping into our tower with their horses!" "Why is their base so well defended?" "They're taking our relief hut
column4: I'm going A.W.O.L.!" Wimps... I took the first train out of "cry-town" the minute the Dark Portal opened. Now I'm a top gun for the Dragonmaw. If you want to be top orc
column5: you'll have to defeat me. We go when you are ready.

column1: Dragonmaw Race: Captain Skyshatter^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Captain Skyshatter^Ja'y Nosliw^^Dragonmaw Race: Wing Commander Mulverick^^Follow Captain Skyshatter while attempting to stay on your flying mount. Should you defeat Captain Skyshatter
column2: report your victory to Ja'y Nosliw at the Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley.^You dare challenge Skyshatter? The world around you will fall into darkness as the heavens are torn asunder by my meteors. You stand no chance
column3: soldier. Yet it is your desire to die... I will entertain this morbid obsession if only to prove a point to any that might foolishly dream of making the same mistake. We ride when you are ready!

column1: Terokk's Downfall^70^All^Skettis^Sky Commander Adaris^Sky Commander Adaris^^Adversarial Blood^^Take the Time-Lost Offering prepared by Hazzik to the Skull Pile at the center of Skettis and summon and defeat Terokk. Return to Sky Commander Adaris when you've completed this task.^I... I've turned a blind eye to your dealings with the arakkoa prisoner
column2: <name>. It looks like your instincts to cooperate with him were right. You must understand... I would've faced a mutiny in my current state if I endorsed your efforts to bring Terokk to this world. Take the items that Hazzik prepared for you and go ahead with your plan. I will command my men to back you up when the time comes. I recommend that you bring a force of your own as well. I fear you'll only get one chance at this.

column1: Tokens of the Descendants^70^All^Terokkar Forest^Hazzik^Hazzik^^Adversarial Blood^^Collect Time-Lost Scrolls from the time-lost arakkoa in Skettis and bring them to a Skull Pile inside a summoning circle in Skettis. Summon and defeat the descendants of Terokk's adversaries and return to Hakkiz with Akkarai's Talon
column2: Garokk's Spine
column3: Vekkaz's Scale and Gezzarak's Claw.^The descendants held prisoner by the Skettis talonpriests are listed in this book. Gezzarak the Huntress
column4: Garokk the Crystal Giant
column5: the heretic known as Darkscreecher Akkarai and Vekkaz the Windrager. They will all need to be slain before Terokk returns to this world. You will need the scrolls carried by the time-lost arakkoa and burn them at the summoning circles all over Skettis. Bring me a token from each one. These are powerful beings you will be facing; you would do well to bring friends.

column1: The Netherwing Mines^70^ ^Shadowmoon Valley^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath^Mistress of the Mines^The Netherwing Mines^Rise
column2: Overseer!^Dragons are the Least of Our Problems
column3: The Great Murkblood Revolt
column4: Crazed and Confused^Seek out the Mistress of the Mines on Netherwing Ledge.^Your help is required at the Netherwing Mines
column5: overseer <name>. Two days ago our mining operations came to a grinding halt when we made a grim discovery. A miner was working in the depths of the mine and struck his pick upon an unusual crystal formation. Unfortunately
column6: this crystal formation was attached to a very angry nether dragon. The beast woke from its slumber and annihilated all of our workers. Report to the Mistress of the Mines. They await you at the mouth of the mines
column7: southwest of here.

column1: Picking Up The Pieces...^70^ ^Shadowmoon Valley^Mistress of the Mines^Mistress of the Mines^The Netherwing Mines^^^The Mistress of the Mines at the Netherwing Mines in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to recover 15 Nethermine Cargo crates.^Much of our hard work lies scattered about in these mines. Carts full of cargo are littered across every inch of this mine! We just can't get to any of it with the current infestation. That's where you come in
column2: <name>. Your daily duty here at this mine is to collect the cargo left behind by the miners and deep mine workers. Gather the nethermine cargo and return it to me or my sister.

column1: Dragons are the Least of Our Problems^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Dragonmaw Foreman^Dragonmaw Foreman^^The Netherwing Mines^^The Dragonmaw Foreman at the Netherwing Mines in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to kill 15 Nethermine Flayers and 5 Nethermine Ravagers.^That dragon waking up riled up a host of other nasty creatures in these mines. Two types are proving to be a thorn in the side of the Dragonmaw: Nethermine flayers and Nethermine ravagers. You must help us by killing them off. All I ask is your involvement once per day. Get in there and kill as many as you can!
To Rule The Skies^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Sky Commander Keller^Sky Commander Keller^^^^Collect Dragon Teeth.^As ye've flown around
column2: ye must have noticed the dragons above. I trust ye haven't fallen victim ta their rage. Help us put an end ta it
column3: <name>! Rivendark and Obsidia lord over this terrace
column4: while Insidion and Furywing rule the skies over yon terrace ta the northeast. Each has a perch on their respective domains. I be wondering if ye and yer friends will go ta one
column5: <lad /lass>
column6: break open an egg and attract the dragon down. Bring me some teeth as proof. Ta rule the skies
column7: it's either them or us.

column1: A Fel Whip For Gahk^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Gahk^Gahk^^A Father's Duty^^Collect a Fel Whip.^Gahk think being smart is dumb sometimes. Gahk not want to think. Me want little <race> to smash big demons! Dey have some chiefs
column2: and da chiefs all have whips to hurt da little demons. You bring Gahk a whip! You challenge demon chief in forge camps at burning
column3: green
column4: fel crystal prism. Use many apexis shards to get dem to come. Dey called Galvanoth
column5: Braxxus
column6: Zarcsin and da Mo'arg Incinerator.

column1: The Relic's Emanation^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Chu'a'lor^Chu'a'lor^The Crystals^^^Gain Apexis Emanations from an Apexis Relic.^Now that you have felt the enlightening vibrations of the apexis relics
column2: it is time for you to further your understanding of their workings. We are very eager to benefit from your observations! As you progress in your ability to attune to the relics
column3: you will gain a higher level of knowledge. This recognition will come in the form of an emanation from the relic. Return to us when you have attained such an emanation.

column1: The Great Murkblood Revolt^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Murkblood Escape Plans^Mistress of the Mines^The Great Murkblood Revolt^The Netherwing Mines^^Take the Murkblood Escape Plans to the Mistress of the Mines.^This document outlines a revolt planned by the Murkblood broken. It seems that the dragon was to be used as a diversion to draw attention away from their escape. Looking at all of the corpses littering the mine
column2: it would be safe to assume that their plans failed. Return the escape plans to the Mistress of the Mines.

column1: Seeker of Truth^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Mistress of the Mines^Mistress of the Mines^The Great Murkblood Revolt^^^Find a Murkblood Overseer and interrogate him. Return to the Mistress of the Mines with the Murkblood information and the Hand of the Overseer.^These miners are far too stupid to concoct any type of escape plan. We must find and punish the source. Venture into the depths of the mine and seek out the Murkblood overseers. If they have not been overcome by the denizens of the mine
column2: they will undoubtedly be hiding. Once you locate one
column3: interrogate him until he reveals the true mastermind behind the escape. Return to me with the identity of this traitor and the hand of the overseer.

column1: Crazed and Confused^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Ronag the Slave Driver^Ronag the Slave Driver^^The Netherwing Mines^^Ronag the Slave Driver in the Netherwing Mines of Shadowmoon Valley wants you to slay the Crazed Murkblood Foreman and 5 Crazed Murkblood Miners.^Don't worry about this dragon
column2: <name>. We've got plans for it... Deeper in this mine is a band of crazed Murkblood. After the dragon broke out
column3: they were cut off from the exit. Somehow
column4: after a mere 2 days of isolation
column5: they've lost all sense of decency. They've resorted to cannibalism and the promotion of mayhem. We don't need that kind of madness in this place. Find 'em and kill 'em. All of 'em.

column1: Stand Tall
column2: Captain!^70^ ^Shadowmoon Valley^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath^Overlord Mor'ghor^^Rise
column3: Overseer!^Disrupting the Twilight Portal
column4: The Soul Cannon of Reth'hedron
column5: Hail
column6: Commander!^Speak with Overlord Mor'ghor at Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley.^Well
column7: well
column8: well... still alive I see. That's good
column9: because Mor'ghor has requested your presence in his tower at once. Get a move on!

column1: Escape from Skettis^70^All^Skettis^Skyguard Prisoner^Sky Sergeant Doryn^^To Skettis!^^Escort the Skyguard Prisoner to safety and report to Sky Sergeant Doryn.^Hail
column2: <name>. I thank you for coming to my aid. The arakkoa's monstrous birds knocked me from my nether ray while on a scouting mission. Let's get out of here
column3: while we can.

column1: Disrupting the Twilight Portal^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Overlord Mor'ghor^Overlord Mor'ghor^^Stand Tall
column2: Captain!^^Overlord Mor'ghor at Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to kill 20 Deathshadow Agents.^One of your responsibilities as a captain of Dragonmaw is to snuff out Burning Legion activity in Outland. It is your duty to silence those that defy Lord Illidan! The demons foolishly attempt to stabilize the portal found on the Twilight Ridge of western Nagrand. They must pay for their treachery
column3: and you will be the orc that collects on their debt. Travel to the Twilight Ridge and lay waste to its inhabitants. You will be responsible for making at least one attack per day on their fortifications.

column1: The Soul Cannon of Reth'hedron^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Illidari Lord Balthas^Illidari Lord Balthas^The Soul Cannon of Reth'hedron^Stand Tall
column2: Captain!^^Illidari Lord Balthas at the Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley wants you to bring him 2 Felsteel Bars
column3: 1 Adamantite Frame
column4: 1 Khorium Power Core and 1 Flawless Arcane Essence.^Reth'hedron now lords over the Twilight Ridge of Nagrand. An eredar of such power being loosed upon this world does not bode well for the Illidari. Alas
column5: we do not have the resources required to slay Reth'hedron. Not with the war the Sha'tar have brought to the Black Temple. No... I have a better plan. You will subdue Reth'hedron
column6: banishing him back through the Twilight Portal. For this a soul cannon must be fashioned. Return to me with the materials on this list.

column1: Subdue the Subduer^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Illidari Lord Balthas^Illidari Lord Balthas^The Soul Cannon of Reth'hedron^^^Illidari Lord Balthas at Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley has tasked you with using the Soul Cannon on Reth'hedron the Subduer in Nagrand.^<Balthas holds up an alien looking device.> This is a soul cannon. Its effects are devastating when attuned. This one is attuned to my blood. The same blood flowing through the veins of Reth'hedron - my brother. Aye
column2: his misplaced allegiance will be the end of him. Take the cannon and fly to the Twilight Ridge in western Nagrand. Locate Reth'hedron and fire! You must stay on your mount and within range for the effects to take hold. Stand your ground against him and he will have no choice but to flee!

column1: A Special Thank You^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Chu'a'lor^Jho'nass^^^^Speak with Jho'nass at Ogri'la in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^You honor us with your efforts on our behalf. And now there is someone that we would like for you to meet. Jho'nass is our most trusted quartermaster. He maintains a stock of goods that we provide for sale to only the most dedicated of friends to Ogri'la. You are one such friend
column2: <name>. When you find the time
column3: go and speak with him. As we understand it
column4: he has prepared a little something for you as a token of our appreciation.

column1: Hail
column2: Commander!^70^ ^Shadowmoon Valley^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath^Overlord Mor'ghor^^Stand Tall
column3: Captain!^Kill Them All!
column4: Kill Them All!^Speak with Overlord Mor'ghor at Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley.^Captain <name>! <Taskmaster Varkule salutes you.> Overlord Mor'ghor has asked to see you in his chambers at once!

column1: Hungry Nether Rays^70^All^Skettis^Skyguard Handler Deesak^Skyguard Handler Deesak^^To Skettis!^^Use the Nether Ray Cage in the woods south of Blackwind Landing and slay Blackwind Warp Chasers near the Hungry Nether Ray. Return to Skyguard Handler Deesak when you've completed your task.^Nether rays are surprisingly loyal and obedient once properly trained. Unfortunately the war on Skettis is taking a toll on them. We have dozens of sorties a day - the poor fellows rarely get a break. And with recent shortages on feed
column2: if those blasted birdmen don't kill them on a mission then starvation will. If you can lend a hand
column3: take one of our rays to the woods in the south. They don't mind warp chaser meat as long as it's a fresh kill.

column1: Kill Them All!^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Overlord Mor'ghor^Arcanist Thelis^Kill Them All!^Hail
column2: Commander!^^Deliver news of your mission along with the Dragonmaw Flare Gun to Arcanist Thelis at the Sanctum of the Stars in Shadowmoon Valley.^Commander <name>
column3: stand at attention! You are to take a battalion of Skybreakers and sack the Scryers' outpost located at the foot of the Netherwing Fields. With the Sanctum of the Stars destroyed
column4: our lines of communication to our posts at Eclipse Point and Illidari Point will once more be open. Go now! Use this flare gun to signal the Skybreakers for the attack!

column1: Commander Hobb^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Arcanist Thelis^Commander Hobb^Kill Them All!^^The Deadliest Trap Ever Laid^Give the Dragonmaw Flare to Commander Hobb at the Sanctum of the Stars in Shadowmoon Valley.^The Dragonmaw only dare attack us when our guard is down. They would face certain defeat if they were to attack us while we were prepared. I want you to let them come
column2: <name>. <Thelis nods.> Yes... a trap. Take this flare that their overlord gave you and deliver it to Commander Hobb. He is standing guard right outside this building.

column1: Threat from Above^70^All^Shattrath City^Yuula^Yuula^Threat from Above^^To Skettis!^Slay any 20 Gordunni Ogres in the Barrier Hills and return to Yuula in Shattrath City.^So you want to join the Skyguard? Well
column2: I know you can fly... but can you fight? The Skyguard is sworn to protect Shattrath from the dangers that loom above us
column3: both near and far. The Gordunni ogres who dwell in the Barrier Hills to the north are an immediate threat to us. Reaching the ogres has been problematic for Shattrath's ground units. That's where we come in. See what you can do to help contain them.

column1: The Deadliest Trap Ever Laid^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Commander Hobb^Overlord Mor'ghor^^Commander Hobb^^Assist Commander Hobb and the Scryers in defending the Sanctum of the Stars. Once all of the Dragonmaw forces have been defeated
column2: return to Overlord Mor'ghor at Dragonmaw Base Camp with the Scryer Medals.^Take these Scryer medals. Mor'ghor will need proof of "victory" once this is over. He will recognize them as coming from the corpses of fallen Scryer soldiers. Now all that remains is to use the signal flare to alert the Dragonmaw raiders. We will crush them when you are ready. Just give me the word.

column1: To Skettis!^70^ ^Skettis^Yuula^Sky Sergeant Doryn^Threat from Above^^Fires Over Skettis
column2: Escape from Skettis
column3: Hungry Nether Rays^Take the Explosives Package to Sky Sergeant Doryn at Blackwind Landing outside Skettis.^The Barrier Hills are only one of the fronts where we've been deployed. A less immediate but far more dangerous threat looms from beyond the Skethyl Mountains
column4: from within the arakkoa city of Skettis. A few months ago our scouts detected a huge increase in arakkoa activity there. Several attacks against Shattrath followed. We've stationed forces outside of their city since. Take these explosives to Sergeant Doryn at Blackwind Landing
column5: just outside Skettis. Tell him you're a new recruit.

column1: Kill Them All!^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Overlord Mor'ghor^Anchorite Ceyla^Kill Them All!^Hail
column2: Commander!^^Deliver news of your mission and the Dragonmaw Flare Gun to Anchorite Ceyla at the Altar of Sha'tar.^Commander <name>
column3: stand at attention! You are to take a battalion of Skybreakers and sack the Aldor outpost located northwest of our beloved Black Temple. With the Altar of Sha'tar destroyed
column4: our lines of communication to our posts at Coilskar will once more be open. Go now! Use this flare gun to signal the Skybreakers for the attack!

column1: Commander Arcus^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Anchorite Ceyla^Commander Arcus^Kill Them All!^^The Deadliest Trap Ever Laid^Give the Dragonmaw Flare to Commander Arcus at the Altar of Sha'tar in Shadowmoon Valley.^The Dragonmaw only dare attack us when our guard is down. They would face certain defeat if they were to attack us while we were prepared. I want you to let them come
column2: <name>. <Ceyla nods.> Yes... a trap. Take this flare that their overlord gave you and deliver it to Commander Arcus. He is standing guard right outside this building.

column1: The Deadliest Trap Ever Laid^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Commander Arcus^Overlord Mor'ghor^^Commander Arcus^^Assist Commander Arcus and the Aldor in defending the Altar of Sha'tar. Once all of the Dragonmaw forces have been defeated
column2: return to Overlord Mor'ghor at Dragonmaw Base Camp with the Aldor Medals.^Take these Aldor medals. Mor'ghor will need proof of "victory" once this is over. He will recognize them as coming from the corpses of fallen Aldor soldiers. Now all that remains is to use the signal flare to alert the Dragonmaw raiders. We will crush them when you are ready. Just give me the word.

column1: Bombing Run^70^All^Druid^Sky Sergeant Vanderlip^Sky Sergeant Vanderlip^Bombing Run^^Bomb Them Again!^Use the Skyguard Bombs to destroy 15 Fel Cannonball Stacks.^You can fly around as a crow... so what! Ever annihilate something on the ground while you were flying? Want to? Forge Camp: Wrath and Forge Camp: Terror
column2: to the north and south
column3: are a major pain in my backside
column4: as well as being a threat to peaceful Ogri'la. With all of those fel cannons shooting down the Skyguard left and right
column5: we can't get through there to take care of business. Want to prove yourself? Take these bombs and knock out their ammo stacks. Just don't let them shoot you down
column6: too!

column1: Bow to the Highlord^70^ ^Shadowmoon Valley^Taskmaster Varkule Dragonbreath^Overlord Mor'ghor^Bow to the Highlord^^^Speak to Overlord Mor'ghor at Dragonmaw Base Camp in Shadowmoon Valley.^I am unworthy to even carry a message directed at you
column2: sir. Please forgive me for this indulgence. Overlord Mor'ghor has requested your presence in his chambers at once!

column1: Lord Illidan Stormrage^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Overlord Mor'ghor^Barthamus^Bow to the Highlord^^Jorus the Cobalt Netherwing Drake
column2: Malfas the Purple Netherwing Drake
column3: Onyxien the Onyx Netherwing Drake
column4: Suraku the Azure Netherwing Drake
column5: Voranaku the Violet Netherwing Drake
column6: Zoya the Veridian Netherwing Drake^Meet Illidan Stormrage. Seek out Barthamus in the Lower City of Shattrath should you survive.^Come
column7: highlord <name>. Illidan himself awaits us!

column1: Assault on Bash'ir Landing!^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Sky Commander Keller^Aether-tech Apprentice^^^^Speak with the Aether-tech Apprentice at Skyguard Outpost in the Blade's Edge Mountains.^Heya
column2: <boyo /girly>! Up fer some fun are ye? Every couple o' hours
column3: me aether-techs launch an assault on Bash'ir Landing
column4: far ta the northeast in the Blade's Edge Mountains. They say that they're there 'studying' the Bash'ir crystalforge
column5: but it's an assault; there be no two ways about it. We use the crystalforge to resupply
column6: and there's always extra to be sold. Go on down ta the landin' pad and speak with the aether-tech apprentice. He'll tell ye when the next mission is ta launch.

column1: Inspecting the Ruins^35^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Captain Garran Vimes^Inspector Tarem^They Call Him Smiling Jim^^^Speak to Inspector Tarem at the Shady Rest Inn.^Poor James never recovered from the destruction of the Shady Rest and the murder of his family. The boys and I are doing what we can to find the monsters who did this. I've sent our best investigator
column2: Inspector Tarem
column3: out to the ruins
column4: but this is too big a job for any one man. If you'd lend Tarem a hand
column5: we'd appreciate it. Light knows
column6: we'd all like to be out there helping. The main road will lead you to the inn
column7: but take care. Your journey will take you beyond the protection of my soldiers.

column1: Inspecting the Ruins^35^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Krog^Inspector Tarem^^^^Speak to Inspector Tarem at the Shady Rest Inn.^If you follow the road south from the village
column2: and then west toward the Barrens
column3: you'll come across the ruins of the Shady Rest Inn. Theramore has sent an investigator to discover how the inn met its fate. Normally
column4: I'd advise you to steer clear
column5: but we have orders from Orgrimmar to 'assist' in the investigation. Accept any help the Theramore investigator offers
column6: even feed him a tidbit or two of information if you'd like
column7: but save your real findings for me.

column1: Traitors Among Us^35^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Calia Hastings^Calia Hastings^Traitors Among Us^^^Confront 5 Deserter Agitators and return to Calia Hastings near the docks in Theramore.^It's good to meet you
column2: <class>. I've come to Theramore to help eliminate the problem of the deserters. Not only have some of the men abandoned their posts
column3: but some have filtered back into the town. These deserter agents are spreading lies and propaganda
column4: hoping to convince others to join their ranks. They're at virtually every guard post throughout the town and the docks. Find them
column5: expose them
column6: and discredit them. At this point
column7: anything more risks inspiring more sympathy for them.

column1: Propaganda War^35^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Calia Hastings^Calia Hastings^Traitors Among Us^^Discrediting the Deserters^Bring the Deserter Propaganda to Calia Hastings near the docks in Theramore.^The deserter agents were doing far more than just chatting up the guards. We've found a number of leaflets the deserters somehow managed to smuggle in on a ship in the docks. The ship used to transport the leaflets is still in Theramore
column2: at the farthest dock. If you can sneak aboard and capture the rest of their propaganda documents
column3: their agents will lose their most powerful tool. Be careful! The ship is manned by seasoned privateers and the cargo is probably being kept in the captain's quarters.

column1: Kyle's Gone Missing!^7^Horde^Mulgore^Ahab Wheathoof^Ahab Wheathoof^^^^Ahab Wheathoof at Bloodhoof Village in Mulgore wants you to feed his prized puppy
column2: Kyle the Frenzied.^Help
column3: <name>! My prized puppy
column4: Kyle
column5: has run away! I just know he's running around Bloodhoof Village
column6: lost and hungry. Will you find him and feed him? Once he eats he will settle down and come home. To feed him you will need to find food. His favorite meal is tender strider meat. Just venture east and you should find plenty of striders. Hunt one down and take its succulent meat to Kyle. When you see Kyle in town
column7: put the meat down and he is sure to come to you.

column1: Oooh
column2: Shinies!^70^All^Zul'Aman^Griftah^Budd Nedreck^Oooh
column3: Shinies!^^^Griftah wants you to take Griftah's Note to Budd in the Ghostlands
column4: just outside of Zul'Aman.^Come closer
column5: <man/sweetheart>! Let ol' Griftah look at yer shiny things.... Hmm. Yeh
column6: yeh
column7: not bad
column8: but ya can do better. Much
column9: much better. <Griftah leans in and whispers.> There be priceless shinies everywhere
column10: <name>
column11: ya just gotta know where to look! It be yer lucky day; I know a fella who can help ya find more shinies than ya can ever carry. Visit my ol' friend
column12: Budd
column13: near Zul'Aman and show him this here. Ya be tellin' him ol' Griftah sent ya and he'll let ya in on his new project.

column1: Promises
column2: Promises...^70^All^Zul'Aman^Budd Nedreck^Budd Nedreck^Oooh
column3: Shinies!^^^Budd Nedreck in Hatchet Hills wants you to retrieve his map from High Priest Nalorakk's terrace in Zul'Aman.^My inscrutable theories confirm rumors of vast treasure in Zul'Aman. There'll be mounts and mansions for everyone! First things first
column4: though. You must earn your share
column5: after all.... Our initial efforts here haven't gone as well as I hoped. In fact
column6: my map
column7: and the recruits I lent it to
column8: have gone missing. They were after a troll-beast named Nalorakk. Forget the crew
column9: I need that map! Succeed
column10: and you'll go down in history as the one who helped Budd Nedreck unlock the secrets of Zul'Aman!

column1: Discrediting the Deserters^35^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Calia Hastings^Calia Hastings^Discrediting the Deserters^Propaganda War^^Calia Hastings wants you to distribute the Altered Leaflets to 6 Theramore Guards
column2: then report back to her near the docks in Theramore.^I've altered the leaflets you captured from the deserters' mercenary friends at the docks. Now
column3: anyone who reads them will get an entirely different view of the deserters and their aims. If we distribute these to enough of the guards
column4: the deserters will be too embarrassed to ever reestablish their presence within our walls. <Calia hands you a stack of the altered leaflets.> Why don't you get started while I plan our next move?

column1: The End of the Deserters^37^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Calia Hastings^Calia Hastings^Discrediting the Deserters^^A Disturbing Development
column2: The Hermit of Swamplight Manor^Capture Gavis Greyshield
column3: then report to Calia Hastings near the docks in Theramore.^Now that we've eliminated the deserters from Theramore
column4: it's time to complete this operation. My local contacts have reported that the deserters base their operations in a ship moored on a small island to the southeast of the docks. Arresting their leader
column5: Gavis Greyshield
column6: should cause the others to lose their will to fight. Find him within the ship and convince him to surrender. I wouldn't be surprised if he puts up a bit of a fight for show
column7: but then surrenders when he understands he can't win.

column1: A Disturbing Development^36^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Lieutenant Aden^Captain Wymor^A Disturbing Development^The End of the Deserters^^Report to Captain Wymor at Sentry Point.^Reports from our scout patrols have recently taken a disturbing turn. They tell of men wearing red Defias bandanas walking the Dreadmurk Shore north of Theramore's walls. Wreckage in the area suggests they may be survivors of a shipwreck
column2: but our information is limited. Captain Wymor at Sentry Point
column3: a guard tower to the north of the city
column4: is looking for help in following up on the reports.

column1: Defias in Dustwallow?^37^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Captain Wymor^Captain Wymor^A Disturbing Development^^^Obtain the Defias Orders from Garn Mathers and bring them to Captain Wymor at Sentry Point.^My scouts have reported a shipwreck just off the beach to the northeast. Shipwrecks aren't all that unusual out here
column2: but the reports also indicated the survivors were all wearing red bandanas! The Defias are craftsmen and guildsmen
column3: not sailors. What are they doing at the site of a shipwreck on a continent they've no interest in? Their leader is rumored to reside on a large island just off the coast to the northeast of the tower. Kill him and retrieve any documents you find in his possession.

column1: Renn McGill^37^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Captain Wymor^Renn McGill^A Disturbing Development^^^Bring the Defias Orders to Renn McGill in the waters off the Dreadmurk Shore.^From the wording of the orders you recovered
column2: it looks like the first priority of the Defias will be to locate and secure whatever cargo they possessed. SI:7 has had a salvage diver named Renn McGill working out of Theramore for some time. When he heard about the shipwreck
column3: Renn went north to dive near the islands the Defias now occupy. If we're to beat the Defias to this cargo
column4: we'll need his help. Look for him in the waters northeast of a small island just north of the island you visited earlier.

column1: Secondhand Diving Gear^37^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Renn McGill^Renn McGill^A Disturbing Development^^^Bring the Tool Kit and Damaged Diving Gear to Renn McGill in the Dustwallow Marsh.^There's plenty of wreckage strewn across the bottom of the water from here to Alcaz
column2: and the Defias have already got divers out there looking around. With the help of some of their gear
column3: we can get you suited up and ready to join the hunt
column4: but you'll have to do some creative "borrowing" first. Search this island for a crate of diving gear and something to repair it with. When you've got them
column5: bring them to me and I'll have your gear ready in no time!

column1: Recover the Cargo!^37^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Renn McGill^Renn McGill^A Disturbing Development^^Jaina Must Know^Bring 6 Salvaged Strongboxes to Renn McGill in Dustwallow Marsh.^Well
column2: I was able to make enough repairs to this gear to let you dive for awhile
column3: anyway. I wouldn't count on it holding out for a long time
column4: though. The wreckage of the ship is strewn along the bottom from the east coast of this island out toward Alcaz Island. While that helm holds out
column5: locate pieces of the wreckage on the bottom between this island and Alcaz. Use this salvage kit to search the wreckage for pieces of the cargo. Be careful not to venture too close to Alcaz Island. Those hydra are fierce.

column1: Jaina Must Know^37^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Renn McGill^Lady Jaina Proudmoore^Jaina Must Know^Recover the Cargo!^^Speak with Lady Jaina Proudmoore in Theramore.^You must bring news of our findings to Lady Jaina without delay! If the Defias were transporting a prisoner
column2: there's no telling who it might be or if the person is still alive! One thing is for certain
column3: <name>. The Defias wouldn't go to all this trouble for some petty grudge. Their prisoner must have been someone of importance. Lady Jaina would know better than anyone else what these findings mean. You'll find her at the top of the mage tower at Theramore's center.

column1: Survey Alcaz Island^37^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Lady Jaina Proudmoore^Lady Jaina Proudmoore^Jaina Must Know^^Proof of Treachery^Speak to Cassa Crimsonwing and use one of her gryphons to survey Alcaz Island. When your survey is complete
column2: speak with Lady Jaina Proudmoore in Theramore.^It looks like Renn's hunch about Alcaz Island was right. We need to survey that island
column3: but it would take a whole brigade of troops to fight our way in there. Theramore's defenses can't weather such a hit
column4: so I've arranged with Cassa Crimsonwing
column5: the apprentice to Theramore's gryphon master
column6: to allow you to use one of her beasts to survey Alcaz from the air. Alcaz Island holds the key to the mystery of the Defias' involvement in this kidnapping.

column1: A Grim Connection^38^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Captain Garran Vimes^Captain Darill^^The Deserters^Confirming the Suspicion
column2: Arms of the Grimtotems^Report to Captain Darill at North Point.^I've spoken with Inspector Tarem regarding the evidence you gathered from the ruins of the Shady Rest Inn. He seems certain that the hoofprints and the shield you found there point to the Grimtotem clan of tauren. With reports of Grimtotem activity on the rise in the marsh
column3: this has to be more than a mere coincidence. I'm sending you to speak with Captain Darill
column4: who is something of an expert on the Grimtotems. Follow the road north out of town to North Point tower. It's the second outpost on the road.

column1: Confirming the Suspicion^38^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Captain Darill^Captain Darill^^A Grim Connection^Tabetha's Assistance^Bring the Grimtotem Battle Plan to Captain Darill at North Point Tower.^The Grimtotems may be the most warlike of all the tauren clans
column2: but they're by no means unorganized. If they're the ones who put the torch to the Shady Rest Inn
column3: they'll have had orders from one of their clan elders. There's a large Grimtotem settlement called Blackhoof Village to the northwest. They've been using it as a base to attack the tower
column4: but I'll bet that you'll find the orders you're looking for there. Check the village's elders for traces of the orders you seek.

column1: Prisoners of the Grimtotems^37^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Sergeant Lukas^Sergeant Lukas^^Raptor Captor^^Sergeant Lukas at North Point Tower wants you to free 5 Theramore Prisoners.^We're doing all we can to keep the Grimtotem raiders at bay
column2: but they keep launching assaults on the tower. Even worse
column3: they've managed to discover and capture the patrols the captain sends out to gather information and safeguard the road. I suspect the captives are being held in Blackhoof Village
column4: to the northwest. Knowing the Grimtotems
column5: the defenders of the village probably carry the keys to the prisoners' cages with them. I don't care what you have to do
column6: <class>
column7: just bring back my men alive.

column1: Raptor Captor^37^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Sergeant Lukas^Sergeant Lukas^^^Prisoners of the Grimtotems
column2: Unleash the Raptors^Sergeant Lukas at North Point Tower wants you to capture 6 raptors. You can capture either Bloodfen Raptors or Bloodfen Screechers.^The patch of swamp to the northeast is home to a particularly nasty breed of raptors. We've lost more than one unwary soldier to them
column3: but I think we can turn them against our Grimtotem neighbors. Take this rope and use it to capture bloodfen raptors or bloodfen screechers that you've subdued. I wouldn't try to capture one of the beasts until you've weakened them quite a bit in combat. It's going to be quite a struggle.

column1: Unleash the Raptors^37^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Sergeant Lukas^Sergeant Lukas^^Raptor Captor^^Sergeant Lukas at North Point Tower wants you to place the Raptor Bait near the windmill in Blackhoof Village.^Now that we've got our raptors
column2: our next move is to "encourage" them to attack the Grimtotems at Blackhoof Village to the northwest. I've got a leftover haunch of... well
column3: it doesn't really matter what it is. It'll be your bait. Set it down on the ground in Blackhoof Village near the windmill in the center of the settlement. The raptors should take care of the rest
column4: if their training took.

column1: Arms of the Grimtotems^38^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Captain Darill^Captain Darill^^A Grim Connection^^Captain Darill at North Point Tower wants you to bring him 7 Blackhoof Armaments.^If the equipment you found at the ruins of the inn belonged to a Grimtotem attack party
column2: there's likely to be more just like it within their camp to the northwest. We haven't been able to gather much information about Blackhoof Village
column3: but judging from the size of the raiding parties
column4: there's a substantial force based there. Do whatever you have to to capture some of their equipment so that we can compare it with your findings from the inn.

column1: Tabetha's Assistance^39^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Captain Darill^Tabetha^Tabetha's Assistance^Confirming the Suspicion^^Speak with Tabetha at her farm.^I can't spare any men to help search for a second Grimtotem outpost
column2: but I think I know of someone who might be able to help you. Deep in the Quagmire
column3: to the south
column4: there is a small farmstead owned by Tabetha. She may seem little more than an old hermit
column5: but the truth is that she's a mage and scryer of some renown. Follow the road south to her farm and seek her help in finding the culprits responsible for the massacre at the Shady Rest Inn.

column1: Raze Direhorn Post!^39^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Tabetha^Tabetha^Tabetha's Assistance^^^Burn the North Tent
column2: East Tent
column3: and the Northeast Tent at Direhorn Post
column4: then return to Tabetha at her farm.^There's no scrying necessary to see the trouble my new "neighbors" are creating. And if this is the band that burnt down the Shady Rest Inn
column5: as you claim
column6: there's no reason to tolerate their presence any longer. Take this torch and raze their camp to the ground! You'll find Direhorn just to the north of my farm. You can't miss it
column7: really
column8: as the Grimtotems have done a splendid job of announcing their presence with those totems they favor.

column1: Justice for the Hyals^39^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Tabetha^Captain Garran Vimes^Tabetha's Assistance^^^Speak to Captain Garran Vimes at Foothold Citadel in Theramore.^Although these Grimtotems were simply a nuisance to me
column2: Captain Vimes will want to know of your deeds. Bring him the news that you have tracked down and dealt with those responsible for the burning of the Shady Rest Inn. It's too late to save Jim Hyal's family
column3: but perhaps the Grimtotems will think twice before attacking anyone connected to Theramore.

column1: Peace at Last^39^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Captain Garran Vimes^Captain Garran Vimes^Tabetha's Assistance^^^Captain Garran Vimes at Foothold Citadel wants you to lay the Wreath at the Hyal Family Monument.^I wish we had a way of letting James Hyal's wife and son know that we have brought their murderers to justice. <Captain Vimes produces a small wreath decorated with flowers.> There are some who say that their spirits will know
column2: even if we cannot reach them. It's not much
column3: but I'd like you to lay this wreath at the Hyal family monument. It's one of the larger stones in the graveyard just north of Theramore's gates.

column1: Break the Blockade^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Bombardier Petrov^Bombardier Petrov^^^^Take Petrov's Cluster Bombs and drop them on enough pirates to kill or destroy 25 Blockade Pirates and 10 Blockade Cannons. Once you've accomplished that
column2: return to Bombardier Petrov at Westguard Keep.^All of our ships are sunk! We need your help to break the pirate blockade below in the Shattered Straits! Take these cluster bombs and hitch a ride on the zeppelin that Harrowmeiser has 'loaned' to us. He'll fly you over the decks of those pirate scoundrels
column3: and you make sure to give it to them good! If you can't bomb them to smithereens
column4: I'm afraid we'll never be able to break the blockade.

column1: Scare the Guano Out of Them!^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Engineer Feknut^Engineer Feknut^^^^Collect 10 Darkclaw Guano and deliver them to Engineer Feknut at Steel Gate.^You
column2: yes you... I need your help! Petrov sent me up here to get bat guano for the cluster bombs he's making back at the keep. He sent me to my doom! The darkclaw bats hang out in the Rivenwood to the north
column3: but I'm not taking a step off of this platform unless it's to go home! But you... you could get it for me! Yes? Pretty please?!!! Here
column4: take these firecrackers. My thinking is that if you drop 'em underneath the bats
column5: the guano will be scared right out of them!

column1: Shoveltusk Soup Again?^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Chef Kettleblack^Chef Kettleblack^^^^Chef Kettleblack has asked you to obtain 6 Shoveltusk Meat and deliver them to her at Westguard Keep.^With all of the strange disappearances of our livestock
column2: we better resupply in a hurry
column3: or the beasties around these parts will be the least of our worries! Seeing as I'm in charge of feeding this lot
column4: I'm going to need you to head east and get me some meat. More to the point
column5: I'm looking to cook us up some tender shoveltusk meat. Just beware the stags... they're mean!

column1: Direhorn Raiders^39^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Apprentice Morlann^Apprentice Morlann^^^^Kill 12 Direhorn Grimtotems and return to Apprentice Morlann at Tabetha's Farm.^The Grimtotems up at Direhorn Post
column2: just to the north
column3: are getting bolder by the day. At night
column4: you can often hear them chanting about their deeds in battle against people who've tried to settle here. They're determined to drive us from Tabetha's farm even though she's trained generations of apprentices here. We've defended the farm as best we can
column5: but Apprentice Garion was wounded in the last attack. Go to Direhorn Post and kill any Grimtotem you can find! The attacks must stop.

column1: The Clutches of Evil^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Captain Adams^Captain Adams^^^Mage-Lieutenant Malister^Destroy 15 Proto-Drake Eggs and 15 Proto-Whelps
column2: and then return to Captain Adams at Westguard Keep.^<name>
column3: I don't trust anyone but you to take care of this. I need the proto-drake eggs and proto-whelps in the burning forest to the southeast destroyed! Since we arrived here
column4: the Ember Clutch has been ablaze; there must be some sort of perverse magic at work. And lately it seems to be growing. My men tell me that if we don't do something quickly
column5: we'll be surrounded on all sides by the fire within a few weeks' time! Get down there and eliminate the threat by destroying those eggs and the proto-whelps.

column1: Bloodfen Feathers^39^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Brogg^Brogg^^^Banner of the Stonemaul
column2: The Essence of Enmity^Bring 5 Bloodfen Feathers to Brogg at Mudsprocket.^Are you startled by Brogg's presence here
column3: little <race>? Don't worry. Goblins at Mudsprocket are Brogg's friends and you can be
column4: too. Brogg left Brackenwall Village when new overlord not take revenge against black dragonkin for destroying old home and killing many of Brogg's old friends. Brogg come here to lay friends spirits to rest and avenge them
column5: but Brogg need help preparing. For ritual
column6: Brogg need feathers with strong magic
column7: like ones worn by raptors at Bloodfen Burrow to the west of town.

column1: Spirits of Stonemaul Hold^41^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Brogg^Brogg^Spirits of Stonemaul Hold^^^Brogg
column2: at Mudsprocket
column3: wants you to put 10 Stonemaul Spirits to rest.^Brogg has completed the totem that will put the spirits of his friends to rest. When the dragonkin came
column4: they killed all Stonemaul who did not flee. Brogg fled with Overlord Mok'Morokk
column5: hoping to lead a counterattack with other Stonemaul survivors. The counterattack never came and the spirits of the Stonemaul dead still haunt Brogg and the others. Take this totem north to Stonemaul Ruins and use it near ogre skeletons to draw the spirit to you. Defeat the spirit to give it rest with its bones.

column1: Banner of the Stonemaul^39^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Brogg^Brogg^^Bloodfen Feathers^^Retrieve the Stonemaul Banner and bring it to Brogg at Mudsprocket.^When the dragons came and took over Brogg's old home
column2: Stonemaul ogres fled and left everything behind
column3: including clan's banner. Brogg knows banner was kept deep in Stonemaul ogre mound
column4: but these days it's called Den of Flame. Brogg must have clan banner to get his revenge on dragons who killed his friends. Brogg's clan's old mound
column5: Den of Flame
column6: is northwest of Mudsprocket and crawling with dragonkin. Banner will be deep inside the cave. Be careful
column7: <name>.

column1: The Essence of Enmity^39^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Brogg^Brogg^^Bloodfen Feathers^^Bring 10 Black Dragonkin Essences to Brogg at Mudsprocket.^To make the totem Brogg will need for his ritual
column2: he must use the essences of the creatures who killed his friends. The hate and anger of Brogg's enemies will fuel the magic of his vengeance. Track down Firemane ash tails
column3: scouts
column4: or scalebanes and use Brogg's totem on their corpses. Only when the dragonkin die will they give up their essences. The creatures you seek swarm over the Den of Flame to the northwest and the Stonemaul Ruins to the north.

column1: Challenge to the Black Flight^41^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Brogg^Brogg^Spirits of Stonemaul Hold^^^Plant the Stonemaul Banner near the entrance to Onyxia's Lair
column2: wait for Onyxia's response
column3: then return to Brogg at Mudsprocket.^Brogg relishes the thought of taking his revenge on the black dragonkin of the marsh. <name>
column4: you have been very helpful in preparing for this moment. Will you help? Take Brogg's clan banner and travel east until you see a cave like a dragon's mouth. At the entrance to that cave
column5: plant Stonemaul banner and issue Brogg's challenge to Onyxia. Brogg and the Stonemaul will have their lands back!
