column1: Undercover Sister^70^All^Ghostlands^Donna Brascoe^Donna Brascoe^^Blood of the Warlord^^Report to Donna Brascoe to collect a reward for your heroism in Zul'Aman. Donna is currently stationed in the Ghostlands
column2: just outside Zul'aman.^<Donna looks around and then whispers to you.> <name>
column3: what I'm about to tell you must remain confidential
column4: understood? I've been sent by the Shattrath Peacekeepers to infiltrate Budd's gang here. Truth be told
column5: since you first arrived you've been a key person of interest in my investigation. But your deeds have since cleared you of any suspicion. In fact
column6: for your slaying of the crazed warlord
column7: Zul'Jin
column8: I'm compelled to reward you for your efforts.

column1: Tuskin' Raiders^70^All^Zul'Aman^Prigmon^Prigmon^Tuskin' Raiders^^^Prigmon needs you to collect 10 Forest Troll Tusks from the trolls in Zul'Aman. Bring them to him at Budd's camp in the Ghostlands.^Ey mon! You be new around 'ere
column2: eh? Lemme ask a favor of ya. Budd's been refinin' his forest troll disguise. Says that he be close now - just be needin' one last touch. Tusks. My skinnin' talents be wasted 'ere. Somethin' about yankin' troll tusks be makin me queasy. Bring me back 10 troll tusks
column3: eh mon?

column1: A Troll Among Trolls^70^All^Zul'Aman^Prigmon^Zungam^Tuskin' Raiders^^^Prigmon has tasked you with locating and assisting his cousin Zungam
column2: somewhere within Zul'Aman.^Lissen mon
column3: there be sumthin' else needs doin fer ol' Prigmon. Zungam
column4: my good-fer-nuthin' cousin
column5: be stuck inside Zul'Aman. He still be alive too - I seen his signal flare just last night! I should be lettin' him rot fer gettin' me tied up in this mess
column6: but he be owin' me big money. Do what ya can to help him out
column7: then leave the collectin' to me!

column1: X Marks... Your Doom!^70^All^Zul'Aman^Budd Nedreck^Budd Nedreck^Oooh
column2: Shinies!^^^Enter Zul'Aman and visit Halazzi's Chamber
column3: Jan'alai's Platform
column4: and Akil'zon's Platform. Report the details of those areas to Budd
column5: at his camp in the Ghostlands.^How did those fools fail? I told them to be careful - even gave them disguises to help them blend in. Ahh
column6: well. The bright side of their failure is that this opportunity falls to you. Succeed
column7: and you'll be well on your way to joining my crew and sharing in the immeasurable fame that will soon be mine. Not that I need any more
column8: mind you. There are yet a few portions of my map that require further exploration before our excavation can be initiated....

column1: The New Plague^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Apothecary Lysander^Apothecary Lysander^The New Plague^^^Apothecary Lysander at Vengeance Landing wants you to recover 10 Intact Plague Containers from the wrecked ship to the southeast.^Not long after Arthas condemned us to this wretched existence
column2: we in the Royal Apothecary Society endeavored to create a plague of our own. A plague that would devour all flesh: living
column3: dead or undead. We've succeeded in creating this plague and we're here to hand deliver it to the Scourge's doorstep. The Alliance intercepted the ship carrying the latest strain engineered in our Undercity laboratories. Head to the wreckage southeast of here and salvage whatever containers you can.

column1: Spiking the Mix^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Apothecary Lysander^Apothecary Lysander^The New Plague^^^Bring 3 Giant Toxin Glands from Giant Tidecrawlers to Apothecary Lysander at Vengeance Landing in Howling Fjord.^I've a feeling the long trip across the sea is affecting the effectiveness of our plague. What is needed is a potent toxin to boost the potency of the strain. The crabs near this beach are a distant relative of the much smaller brown-shelled tidecrawler. The smaller tropical variety produces a paralytic toxin strong enough to knock out an ogre. As we all know bigger is better! The much larger glands on the local variety should prove more potent. Bring me a few!

The Grimtotem Weapon^38^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Apprentice Garion^Apprentice Garion^^^^Apprentice Garion at Tabetha's Farm wants you to test the Captured Totem on 10 Mottled Drywallow Crocolisks or Drywallow Daggermaws.^During the last Grimtotem attack
column2: I was wounded
column3: but not before I managed to capture a curious totem our enemies were using against us. It seemed to be emitting raw bolts of energy during the battle
column4: but in all my experiments
column5: I haven't managed to figure out how it works. I'll loan the totem to you if you agree to help me test it. The watery areas surrounding the farm are home to pesky mottled drywallow crocolisks and drywallow daggermaws. Try fighting the crocolisks near the totem.

column1: Test at Sea^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Apothecary Lysander^Apothecary Lysander^The New Plague^^New Agamand^Speak to Bat Handler Camille and take a riding bat to intercept the Alliance reinforcements. Once above their fleet
column2: use the Plague Vials to infect 16 North Fleet reservists.^We've just received word of reinforcements coming to the aid of the Alliance forces. Their timing couldn't be better! We're in sore need of test subjects and these North Fleet reservists will do nicely! Take these plague vials with you and speak to Camille
column3: the Bat Handler. Tell her you need to commandeer a riding bat for a special assignment for us. Once you're at sea
column4: drop the vials on the reinforcement fleet. I can't wait to see the results!

column1: Hex Lord? Hah!^70^All^Zul'Aman^Budd Nedreck^Budd Nedreck^Oooh
column2: Shinies!^^^Budd Nedreck in Hatchet Hills wants you to kill Hex Lord Malacrass in Zul'Aman.^Excellent! Everything's nearly ready for my grand entrance into Zul'Aman. You've done a fine job
column3: <name>. I've spoken with my crew and they're warming up to you nicely. I'd say you're very close to becoming a permanent member of the team. Only one thing remains for you to do - dispatch that 'Hex Lord' fellow. Nothing to it
column4: really. You stand up to this wretch and he'll likely just turn and run. Weaker
column5: older trolls just add intimidating titles to their name to make up for their deficiencies
column6: you see?

column1: The Zeppelin Crash^40^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Apprentice Morlann^Moxie Steelgrille^^^Corrosion Prevention^Speak with Moxie Steelgrille at Beezil's Wreck.^Not long ago
column2: a goblin zeppelin crashed to the east. A representative of the Steamwheedle Cartel passed through here a few days ago. She was looking for information about the zeppelin's cargo and it's pilot
column3: Beezil
column4: but none of us really got a good look at the crash. I doubt she'll be able to clean up after the wreck by herself
column5: much less recover whatever cargo the vessel might have carried. If you have time
column6: you may want to check up on her out at Beezil's Wreck
column7: due east of here
column8: near the mountains.

column1: The Reagent Thief^39^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Apprentice Garion^Apprentice Garion^^^^Bring 6 vials of Marsh Venom to Apprentice Garion at Tabetha's Farm.^If there's one thing you can count on Apprentice Morlann to do
column2: it's whine about reagents. Normally
column3: I just ignore him
column4: and it never works. This time
column5: I'm going to try something different. Maybe if I replace the missing reagents before he notices
column6: he'll leave me alone. The most common reagent we both use is marsh venom
column7: which comes from the darkfang creepers and noxious shredders in the marsh north of the farm. If you bring me the venom
column8: I'll replace it before Morlann notices it's gone.

column1: Corrosion Prevention^40^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Moxie Steelgrille^Moxie Steelgrille^^The Zeppelin Crash^^Moxie Steelgrille wants you to dissolve 10 oozes and report back to her at Beezil's Wreck.^Just look at this area! It's swarming with oozes. If I don't find some way to keep them under control
column2: they'll corrode the wreckage and the zeppelin's cargo! I can't go back empty-handed
column3: <class>! Help me dissolve these oozes before they've digested everything! This device
column4: when powered
column5: will concentrate energy on the slimes
column6: causing them to explode. The zeppelin's fragmented power core should power the device. The one near the main crash works all the time
column7: but the others flicker on and off.

column1: My Daughter^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Old Man Stonemantle^Overseer Irena Stonemantle^^Leader of the Deranged^^Old Man Stonemantle has asked you to find his daughter
column2: Overseer Irena Stonemantle
column3: at Steel Gate.^Tell me
column4: is it true? Did the explorers that went into Whisper Gulch go mad? My daughter is the overseer of the Explorers' League that went north to some place called Steel Gate. With the horrible events that have befallen us
column5: I fear for her safety. Please
column6: <class>
column7: I am too old to make the journey. Her name is Irena. Will you go make certain that she is alright?

column1: See to the Operations^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Overseer Irena Stonemantle^Steel Gate Chief Archaeologist^See to the Operations^Leader of the Deranged^^Explorer Irena Stonemantle has asked you to speak with a Steel Gate Chief Archaeologist at Steel Gate.^Our work out here is really just beginning. But now that we've brought these flying machines in from Westguard Keep
column2: it should really pick up. The problem is that we're lacking enough qualified pilots. And with things getting worse in the Rivenwood to the north
column3: I'd like to get things wrapped up here quickly and then head back home. If you can lend a hand
column4: go have a chat with one of my chief archaeologists. You'll find them next to the flying machines on the north and south sides of the site.

column1: The Hermit of Swamplight Manor^36^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Sergeant Amelyn^"Swamp Eye" Jarl^^The End of the Deserters^^Speak to "Swamp Eye" Jarl at Swamplight Manor.^There's a fellow the locals know as "Swamp Eye" Jarl
column2: who lives alone out in the swamp. Sometime ago he "took over" Swamplight Manor after the previous owners disappeared under mysterious circumstances. I like to send someone to check up on him every once in a while. He kind of reminds me of my grandfather
column3: you know? Some say he's not quite right in the head. If you're headed northwest on the road out of Theramore
column4: you'll find Swamplight Manor in the Witch Hill area
column5: before the road turns west.

column1: Blood of the Warlord^70^All^Zul'Aman^Blood of Zul'jin^Budd Nedreck^^^Undercover Sister^Bring the Blood of Zul'jin to Budd at his camp in the Ghostlands
column2: outside Zul'Aman.^As you examine the pulsating vial
column3: your thoughts turn to the petulant little man outside Zul'Aman. You can't wait to see Budd's expression when he sees this!

column1: What's Haunting Witch Hill?^36^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Mordant Grimsby^Mordant Grimsby^What's Haunting Witch Hill?^^^Mordant Grimsby at Swamplight Manor wants you to gather information from 10 Risen Husks or Risen Spirits.^I traveled out here to pay Jarl a visit at his new home and it's been a nonstop horror show ever since! There's something seriously wrong here and I can't be the only one who sees it... Have you seen the ghosts and corpses shambling about Witch Hill? I've a feeling that if anyone knows what happened here
column2: it is them. Seek out these risen husks and risen spirits in the surrounding area
column3: grant them rest through combat
column4: and see what you can learn from them before this evil consumes Jarl!

column1: The Witch's Bane^36^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Mordant Grimsby^Mordant Grimsby^What's Haunting Witch Hill?^^^Bring 9 sprigs of Witchbane to Mordant Grimsby at Swamplight Manor.^In my years as an herbalist
column2: I've often observed that nature will provide subtle cures to the most vexing of problems. I've read that hedge mages and witch doctors often use the smoke of an herb known as witchbane to draw evil from its hiding places. If true
column3: this would mean witchbane should be growing near the shallow waters of Witch Hill. You should be able to identify it by its broad leaves and reddish central stalk. Bring me any of the herb you can find
column4: <name>. It may be our only hope.

column1: Root Causes^71^All^Howling Fjord^Ember Clutch Ancient^Ember Clutch Ancient^^^^Slay 5 Dragonflayer Handlers and Skeld Drakeson. If you manage to do so
column2: return to an Ember Clutch Ancient in the Ember Clutch.^All things in nature seek a balance. It is only through the interference of those not in tune with that harmony that the balance is shifted. You waste your efforts when you kill the whelps and drakes. The real culprits behind the expansion of these magically burning woods are the newly awakened vrykul and their master
column3: Skeld Drakeson. If it's blood on your hands that you seek
column4: start with them. You will find their lair on the south side of the Ember Clutch.

column1: Cleansing Witch Hill^36^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Mordant Grimsby^Mordant Grimsby^What's Haunting Witch Hill?^^^Mordant Grimsby at Swamplight Manor wants you to plant the torch at the end of the dock and defeat anything that appears.^The torch is ready. Plant it at the end of the dock and be prepared to face whatever comes forth. I have no idea what the torch's smoke may reveal... if anything emerges at all. I must say
column2: I have my doubts about this kind of folk magic
column3: but we haven't time for anything else. For your sake and Jarl's
column4: I wish you luck.

column1: WANTED: Goreclaw the Ravenous^39^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Wanted Poster^Drazzit Dripvalve^^^^Kill Goreclaw the Ravenous and report to Drazzit Dripvalve at Mudsprocket.^Travelers and Steamwheedle personnel working in the field are advised to avoid the Bloodfen Burrow to the west of town. The area is overrun with raptors lead by the cruel and cunning Goreclaw the Ravenous
column2: who has already killed at least two Steamwheedle engineers. Drazzit Dripvalve has authorized a generous reward to be paid to the individual who rids Mudsprocket of this menace.

column1: The Apothecary's Letter^38^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Sealed Letter^Andello Porter^^^^Bring the Sealed Letter to Andello Porter at Tabetha's Farm.^Recovered from the body of a Forsaken apothecary
column2: this letter contains alarming evidence of a close alliance between the Grimtotems and the new masters of Lordaeron. "As a demonstration of good faith and a symbol of our newfound trust
column3: we have dispatched Apothecary Cylla to aid you in battling our mutual enemy in the land of Kalimdor. None will stand before our combined might and determination." This letter should be brought to the attention of the SI:7 agent at Tabetha's Farm
column4: Andello Porter.

column1: Signs of Treachery?^38^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Sealed Letter^Nazeer Bloodpike^^^^Bring the Sealed Letter to Nazeer Bloodpike in Brackenwall Village.^Recovered from the body of a Forsaken apothecary
column2: this letter hints at an underground correspondence between Undercity and the Grimtotem leadership. "As a demonstration of good faith and a symbol of our newfound trust
column3: we have dispatched Apothecary Cylla to aid you in battling our mutual enemy in the land of Kalimdor. None will stand before our combined might and determination." Perhaps Nazeer Bloodpike in Brackenwall Village will know how to handle this information.

column1: Mage-Lieutenant Malister^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Captain Adams^Mage-Lieutenant Malister^Mage-Lieutenant Malister^The Clutches of Evil^^Captain Adams has asked you to speak with his advisor
column2: Mage-Lieutenant Malister
column3: at Westguard Keep.^THIS IS OUTRAGEOUS! Those proto-drakes are attacking the keep! Beasts such as that should have been scared off when you took care of their clutches and whelps. You did take care of them
column4: right? <name>
column5: this calls for more direct action. Speak with my advisor
column6: Mage-Lieutenant Malister. He'll provide you with the means to get at those infernal creatures.

column1: Two Wrongs...^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Mage-Lieutenant Malister^Mage-Lieutenant Malister^Mage-Lieutenant Malister^^Report to Scout Knowles
column2: Danger! Explosives!
column3: Send Them Packing^Mage-Lieutenant Malister at Westguard Keep has tasked you with the destruction of 3 Proto-Drakes.^Now that we've riled up these Ember Clutch proto-drakes
column4: they may be inclined to continue their attacks upon the keep. This will not do. I hate to compound one wrong with another
column5: but in this case it would appear that we will have to destroy the creatures. A regrettable course of action
column6: but one that we need to undertake regardless. Take my wand. I've been experimenting with increasing its range
column7: but it doesn't pack much of a punch. However
column8: what it will do is get a proto-drake's attention.

column1: One Last Time^72^All^Howling Fjord^Tarnished Promise Ring^ ^^^^Escort the Ghost of Explorer Jaren safely to Explorer Irena Stonemantle at Steel Gate in the Howling Fjord.^Hello there. Am I dead? I think I am
column2: because I'm hovering over my body! Oh
column3: what an unfortunate turn of events. I was about to propose to Irena when the Scourge descended on us. I know that she's still alive... I can feel her in my heart. <class>
column4: do you think you might safely get me to her? The Scourge can still see my ghost
column5: and no doubt can do horrible things to me. I'd like to look upon her beautiful face one last time. You can tell her that I love her for me.

column1: One Size Does Not Fit All^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Cannoneer Ely^Cannoneer Ely^^^^Cannoneer Ely has tasked you with rounding up 10 Westguard Cannonballs and returning them to him at Westguard Keep.^<Lad /Lass>
column2: who's the genius that made our cannons a non-standard size? Now we have ta make special cannonballs ta shoot out o' the infernal contraptions! I would look kindly on ye if ye would go out and find the balls we've already shot. No doubt with the way these louts shoot they be all o'er the place ta the south and east. <The cannoneer spaces his hands apart to give you an idea of how big the cannonballs are.> That would be faster than us making 'em from scratch fer a certainty.

column1: This Old Lighthouse^35^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Sergeant Amelyn^Babs Fizzletorque^This Old Lighthouse^^^Speak to Babs Fizzletorque at the lighthouse on the island east of Theramore.^The old lighthouse out to the east hasn't worked for some time
column2: but Babs Fizzletorque has gotten it into her head to get it working again. I don't know how she plans to do it by herself
column3: but she claims that it'll make the movement of ships and goods into the docks smoother
column4: so I can't really object. Drawing duty on the docks is really nothing to complain about when you could be on the front lines
column5: you know?

column1: Thresher Oil^35^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Babs Fizzletorque^Babs Fizzletorque^This Old Lighthouse^^^Bring 4 containers of Thresher Oil to Babs Fizzletorque at the lighthouse near Theramore.^The old log in the lighthouse indicates that the lamp was fueled with oil from the threshers that live along the coast here. <Babs wrinkles her nose at the mention of such outdated technology.> I suppose it's a practical
column2: if inelegant solution. The log says that the oil taken from the youngest murk threshers works the best
column3: and those live right underneath the docks of Theramore. If you're up for it
column4: would you help resupply the lighthouse with fuel?

column1: Dastardly Denizens of the Deep^35^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Babs Fizzletorque^"Dirty" Michael Crowe^This Old Lighthouse^^^Bring Dastardly Denizens of the Deep to "Dirty" Michael Crowe on the Theramore docks.^You know
column2: it's amazing what you can find in that old lighthouse. After I lit the lamp
column3: I noticed this book in one of the old trunks up there. <Babs holds up the book and reads the title dramatically.> "Dastardly Denizens of the Deep!" Why
column4: I think I might swoon if I ever saw one of these! I'm sure it's good for a laugh or two
column5: but I simply don't have time for reading right now. You know who might enjoy it
column6: though... that fishmonger on the docks
column7: "Dirty" Michael Crowe. He collects old books.

column1: Is it Real?^36^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^"Dirty" Michael Crowe^Nat Pagle^This Old Lighthouse^^^Talk to Nat Pagle at Nat's Landing in Dustwallow Marsh.^Oh
column2: I'm sure you and Babs had a good laugh over the outlandish descriptions and sketches in the book
column3: but have you stopped to consider there might be some truth to the legends? If you listen closely enough
column4: I bet you can still hear sailors talk about Tethyr
column5: the sea creature the book says lives right here! Of course
column6: if you wanted to know for sure
column7: you could always ask old Nat Pagle. He's got a small fishing camp on a little island in Tidefury Cove
column8: which is southwest across Dustwallow Bay.

column1: Playin' With Dolls^70^All^Zul'Aman^Zungam^Griftah^Tuskin' Raiders^^^Take the Tattered Voodoo Doll to Griftah in Shattrath City.^I'm touched
column2: <name>
column3: an' dat be da truth. I'm not rememberin' the last time a <race> helped Zungam outta trouble. I snatched this from one of them savages when he was busy chainin' me up. It don't look like much
column4: but if anyone can determine its worth
column5: it be my good friend
column6: Griftah! If ya be makin' it outta here alive
column7: it might be worth takin' this to him out in Shattrath City.

column1: Take Down Tethyr!^36^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Major Mills^Major Mills^This Old Lighthouse^^^Major Mills at the Theramore docks wants you to defeat Tethyr.^Sea monster or no
column2: we're not going to risk the safety of our shipping. I've ordered our best marksmen to prepare for a confrontation with this Tethyr. The artillerymen have augmented the dock's defenses with three mortars. I'm going to order the lighthouse's lamp illuminated. If Tethyr does attack
column3: it will be your job to operate the mortars and take down the beast before it can kill all of the marksmen. I wouldn't stand in one place too long
column4: though. Using the mortars is likely to draw its attention.

column1: Report to Scout Knowles^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Captain Adams^Scout Knowles^Report to Scout Knowles^Two Wrongs...^^Captain Adams has asked you to report to Scout Knowles at the Ember Spear Tower.^<name>
column2: now that those damnable proto-creatures have been dealt with
column3: I've another task for you. One of my scouts has reported back some suspicious activity by the Forsaken to the south. It looks like they're up to no good at the vrykul village known as Halgrind. I want you to personally take over the investigation down there. Speak with Scout Knowles to find out what he's uncovered and proceed from there. His last reported position is at the Ember Spear Tower
column4: just to the west of Halgrind.

column1: More than Coincidence^37^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Krog^Krog^^Return to Krog^^Krog at Brackenwall Village wants you to bring him 7 Blackhoof Armaments.^We've gleaned as much as we can from the ruins of the inn. I'm concerned about where the investigation will lead us from here
column2: but we must know the truth. Between the hoofprints and the shield with Mosarn's mark
column3: I'm lead to believe that the Grimtotems may have been involved. They've recently established a settlement in the swamp
column4: Blackhoof Village to the northeast. Travel to Blackhoof Village and search for more arms of Mosarn's manufacture.

column1: The Grimtotem Plot^38^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Krog^Krog^^Return to Krog^Seek Out Tabetha^Bring the Grimtotem Battle Plan to Krog at Brackenwall Village.^With the activities of the Grimtotems in Thousand Needles brought to light
column2: many tauren now regard them with suspicion. We've seen high-ranking Grimtotems engage in murder and kidnapping to advance their interests and I fear we may become their next target. Blackhoof Village
column3: to the northeast
column4: near Bluefen
column5: is a large new Grimtotem settlement. Their leaders
column6: the elders
column7: will all have orders from Thunder Bluff. See if you can capture the orders and piece them together to learn the Grimtotems' plans.

column1: Mission: Eternal Flame^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Scout Knowles^Scout Knowles^Report to Scout Knowles^^^Scout Knowles at the Ember Spear Tower has recommended that you use the Ever-burning Torches to destroy the four Plague Tanks surrounding Halgrind.^The Forsaken are up to no good and from what I can tell
column2: those plague tanks of sludge are a big part of it. If I may suggest
column3: <sir /ma'am>
column4: we should probably destroy them before they can get any more use out of the things. I took the liberty of preparing a bundle of torches from the Ember Clutch. These things have been burning for days! Here
column5: I'm sure you can put them to better use than I in destroying those tanks.

column1: Seek Out Tabetha^37^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Krog^Tabetha^Seek Out Tabetha^The Grimtotem Plot^^Speak with Tabetha at her farm in the Quagmire.^The arms you captured in Blackhoof Village have not seen any combat beyond mere training exercises
column2: which means the Grimtotems who destroyed the Shady Rest are still at large. To the south
column3: in the heart of the Quagmire
column4: lives the witch Tabetha. Though she is a human
column5: she has dealt honorably with us and trained some of our mages. Ask her for assistance in tracking down the band of Grimtotem responsible for burning the inn. The Alliance must not be allowed to think we were complicit in the attack.

column1: Return to Krog^38^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Mosarn^Krog^^Questioning Reethe^More than Coincidence
column2: The Grimtotem Plot^Speak with Krog at Brackenwall Village.^I hope I've been helpful to you and I'm sorry I can't offer more information. My apprentices and I produce such a large volume of arms and armor that it's almost impossible to recall details about any individual piece. Not only do we outfit the braves defending tauren lands
column3: but the Grimtotems have a particular fondness for my work. A seasoned warrior knows good work when he sees it.

column1: Raze Direhorn Post!^39^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Tabetha^Tabetha^Seek Out Tabetha^^^Burn the North Tent
column2: East Tent
column3: and the Northeast Tent at Direhorn Post
column4: then return to Tabetha at her farm.^There's no scrying necessary to see the trouble my new "neighbors" are creating. And if this is the band that burnt down the Shady Rest Inn
column5: as you claim
column6: there's no reason to tolerate their presence any longer. Take this torch and raze their camp to the ground! You'll find Direhorn just to the north of my farm. You can't miss it
column7: really
column8: as the Grimtotems have done a splendid job of announcing their presence with those totems they favor.

column1: Justice Dispensed^39^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Tabetha^Krog^Seek Out Tabetha^^^Return to Krog at Brackenwall Village.^I doubt the Grimtotems will give up their campaign to drive humans from the marsh. At least we have dealt with the perpetrators of the crimes at the Shady Rest Inn. I'm sure the investigator who sent you doesn't need to be told this
column2: but the Horde can no longer afford not to rein in the Grimtotems. There will be a day when their actions will put the Horde in a regrettable position. Neither Lady Jaina nor Warchief Thrall desire another war
column3: but are they willing to do what's necessary to avoid it?

column1: Secure the Cargo!^39^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Moxie Steelgrille^Moxie Steelgrille^Secure the Cargo!^^^Moxie Steelgrille at Beezil's Wreck wants you to recover 8 pieces of Zeppelin Cargo.^This zeppelin was carrying six months' worth of supplies to us at Mudsprocket! Sure
column2: they've been able to barter for some of what they need
column3: but they won't hold out forever. I've been sent out here to recover what I can of the cargo
column4: but the wreckage is scattered all over the marsh in this area. I'm sure a lot of the cargo didn't survive the crash
column5: but are you willing to help me recover what we can?

column1: Delivery for Drazzit^39^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Moxie Steelgrille^Drazzit Dripvalve^Secure the Cargo!^^^Take the Zeppelin Cargo to Drazzit Dripvalve at Mudsprocket.^Drazzit will expect to hear something from me soon
column2: but I don't think the site is secure enough for me to leave. If you have time
column3: would you be willing to take some of the salvaged cargo down to him at Mudsprocket? If you haven't been there yet
column4: it's a small settlement to the southwest of here
column5: beyond the Stonemaul Ruins. You can take the road there from Tabetha's Farm
column6: too. When you get to Mudsprocket
column7: the guy you're looking for is Drazzit Dripvalve.

column1: Nat's Bargain^37^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Nat Pagle^Nat Pagle^This Old Lighthouse^^^Nat Pagle at Nat's Landing wants you to test his new fish bait.^So you found a copy of Dastardly Denizens of the Deep
column2: did you? Well
column3: I can tell you from experience
column4: it's all true. I've even seen a few of 'em with my own eyes. But you want to know about Tethyr. I said I'd make you a deal
column5: so here's what I want you to do. I'm working on a new line of baits
column6: but I haven't tested this one yet. Just take this paste -- yeah
column7: it smells a little foul -- smear it on yourself
column8: and swim over to that wrecked ship to the southwest. If you survive
column9: let me know how it works!

column1: Oh
column2: It's Real^37^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Nat Pagle^Major Mills^This Old Lighthouse^^^Speak with Major Mills at the docks in Theramore.^Yes
column3: Tethyr is certainly real
column4: and he lives in the waters off Theramore. Has a thing for bright lights. He's the reason they shut down the lighthouse in the first place
column5: you know... And if you light it up again
column6: he'll come right back. But no one in their right mind would do that. So that must be your plan! It's been good sharing a drink with you
column7: but don't blame ol' Nat if Tethyr REALLY turns you into fish bait. If you're going to do this
column8: make sure you consult Major Mills at the Theramore docks.

column1: Help for Mudsprocket^39^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Tabetha^Drazzit Dripvalve^^^^Speak with Drazzit Dripvalve at Mudsprocket.^When that goblin... what's her name... Boxie
column2: Foxy... Moxie
column3: that's it! Anyway
column4: when she came through here on her way to the zeppelin wreck
column5: she said the town of Mudsprocket was having some problems. That crashed zeppelin was bringing them fresh supplies. If you follow the road south from here
column6: past the Stonemaul Ruins
column7: you'll eventually come to Mudsprocket. Why don't you check in with Drazzit Dripvalve down there and see if there's anything you can do to help?

column1: Tabetha's Farm^37^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Guard Byron^Tabetha^^^^Speak with Tabetha at her farm in the Quagmire.^Deep in the heart of the swamp lives an old woman named Tabetha. We've never really known much about her
column2: save that she's a good deal older than she appears. She's helped us from time to time and helped keep the peace here between the Horde and our forces. She used to keep in regular contact
column3: but we haven't received one lately. Could you check in with her when you have time? Just follow the road beyond North Point Tower
column4: where it turns south and into the Quagmire. You can see her farm from the road.

column1: Check Up on Tabetha^37^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Nazeer Bloodpike^Tabetha^^^^Speak to Tabetha at her farm in the Quagmire.^A human woman named Tabetha lives on a small farm near the middle of the marsh. Ordinarily
column2: I wouldn't associate with a human
column3: but her help has proven useful at times. Unfortunately
column4: she's been out of touch for quite some time now and I'm looking for someone to travel down to her farm to see if everything's all right. If you follow the road south out of the village
column5: then into the swamp's interior
column6: you'll find her farm near the middle of the Quagmire.

column1: Mission to Mudsprocket^39^Alliance^Dustwallow Marsh^Lieutenant Aden^Drazzit Dripvalve^^^^Speak with Drazzit Dripvalve at Mudsprocket.^The Steamwheedle Cartel has recently established a new outpost in the southern part of Dustwallow Marsh. It's called Mudsprocket
column2: if I recall
column3: and it's located on the main road south out of Tabetha's Farm and the Stonemaul Ruins. This is an excellent opportunity for us to establish new trade contacts and Lady Jaina wants me to send a representative down there to establish contact. Would you be willing to go?

column1: Help Mudsprocket^39^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Nazeer Bloodpike^Drazzit Dripvalve^^^^Speak with Drazzit Dripvalve at Mudsprocket.^The Steamwheedle Cartel's new outpost in the southern part of the marsh isn't faring so well. The zeppelin carrying supplies to Mudsprocket crashed
column2: leaving them without vital tools
column3: food
column4: and medical supplies. Follow the road down south and into the marsh's interior. You'll pass by Tabetha's Farm and the Stonemaul Ruins before the road brings you to Mudsprocket. Offer any help you can provide to the town's leadership.

column1: Archmage Alturus^70^All^Deadwind Pass^Apprentice Tasserel^Archmage Alturus^^^^Speak to Archmage Alturus outside of Karazhan in Deadwind Pass.^I was sent here by my mentor to look for assistance
column2: but unfortunately I'm not allowed outside of Lower City and the individuals that frequent this establishment tend to be less than helpful. You do seem different
column3: more like the adventurous type. If you're interested in aiding our cause
column4: speak to Archmage Alturus outside of Medivh's old dwelling
column5: Karazhan. In the meantime
column6: I'm going to see about gaining access to the rest of the city. One of our old associates is rumored to be here.

column1: Catch a Dragon by the Tail^40^All^Dustwallow Marsh^Gizzix Grimegurgle^Gizzix Grimegurgle^^^^Gizzix Grimegurgle at Mudsprocket wants you to bring him 8 Wyrmtail stalks.^With the zeppelin crash delaying supplies
column2: we've run out of medicines and bandages. We're making use of what we can
column3: but between all the insects
column4: the injuries
column5: and the enemies we're encountering here
column6: I can barely keep up! I've found one herb that seems to help heal wounds and dull pain
column7: but it
column8: too
column9: is in short supply. It's called wyrmtail
column10: and it's abundant in the Dragonmurk and Wyrmbog areas east of town. The plants themselves are made of coiled stalks
column11: and seem to pulsate when you look at them.

column1: Danger! Explosives!^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Sapper Steelring^Sapper Steelring^Danger! Explosives!^Two Wrongs...^^Use Steelring's Foolproof Dynamite to collect 6 Whisper Gulch Ore Fragments and 18 Whisper Gulch Gems. Then return them to Sapper Steelring at Westguard Keep.^<name>
column2: the captain's tasked me with a mission. I'd like you to help. A bunch of my fellow Explorers' League people went nuts digging up stuff in the Whisper Gulch just to the north. They're attacking anyone trying to get in! The captain is only concerned with the ore for the keep. Lucky for us
column3: I have just the thing to do the trick. Get in there
column4: blow up the ore
column5: and bring it back along with any gems you find. Running this place isn't cheap you know! I gotta warn you though
column6: that ore is strange!

column1: Reports from the Field^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^High Executor Anselm^High Executor Anselm^War is Hell^^^Speak to Dark Ranger Lyana and Deathstalker Razael in the battlefield at the Bleeding Vale south of Vengeance Landing. Return to High Executor Anselm when you've completed this task.^Our mission in Northrend is to destroy Arthas. The Alliance are but an obstacle that we'll crush wherever we find them. We've managed to destroy their easternmost fleet; but the survivors have barricaded themselves on the Derelict Strand
column2: south of here. Our forces should've overwhelmed their make-shift defenses long ago
column3: but we underestimated their will to live. Seek my officers in the field
column4: Dark Ranger Lyana and Deathstalker Razael and get them to report on the situation.

column1: Send Them Packing^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Explorer Abigail^Explorer Abigail^^Two Wrongs...^^Explorer Abigail has asked you to /raise your hand at 10 Abandoned Pack Mules and then return to her at Westguard Keep.^I've heard rumors of bad happenings in the Whisper Gulch to the north. Most of the Explorers' League went down into that place
column2: and some say they went mad with what they discovered. That doesn't change the fact that they took most of our mules and equipment with them
column3: though. I won't lose those mules! If you find yourself in there
column4: and happen across any of my mules
column5: just get up close on them and threaten them with a raised hand. They'll spook and come home for sure.

column1: The Hermit of Witch Hill^36^Horde^Dustwallow Marsh^Draz'Zilb^"Swamp Eye" Jarl^The Hermit of Witch Hill^^^Speak with "Swamp Eye" Jarl at Swamplight Manor.^The marsh seems to have a strange effect on humans. Some grow mad simply by living here. Anyone who has ever settled at Swamplight Manor has gone mad in a spectacular way. The latest owner
column2: one "Swamp Eye" Jarl
column3: is already showing signs. I don't completely understand what's happening there
column4: you'd have my thanks for looking into it. The manor is at the eastern edge of the swamp. Trek east across Bluefen and past North Point Tower. The manor is in a haunted patch of land called Witch Hill.

column1: Let Them Eat Crow^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Pontius^Pontius^Let Them Eat Crow^^^Pontius
column2: the kennel keeper at Vengeance Landing
column3: wants you to use the Plaguehound Cage to summon a Hungry Plaguehound and feed it Crow Meat from Fjord Crows west of Vengeance Landing.^The high executor wants me to use my dogs to sniff out enemy scouts
column4: but I can tell you right now these plaguehounds aren't going anywhere until they're properly fed. If our military doesn't understand that these beasts are picky enough to not eat the rubbish they've given me
column5: then they can't expect them to be of any use in the field. You seem to have some time on your hands
column6: why don't you take one of these dogs out hunting for crows out west? Their meat isn't very tasty to us
column7: but my boys love it!

column1: Hell Has Frozen Over...^70^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Macalroy^Vice Admiral Keller^Hell Has Frozen Over...^^^Speak with Vice Admiral Keller at Valgarde Port.^Fordragon's got another thing coming if he thinks the group of green-gilled scrubs he sent to defend this port can hold out much longer. <Macalroy raises an eyebrow as he examines your equipment.> You
column2: however
column3: might fare a bit better. The importance of holding this port cannot be stated enough; and with those monsters flying overhead
column4: the situation around here has gone from bad to worse. Report to Vice Admiral Keller just northwest of here and let him know that you're all out of bubble gum.

column1: The Windrunner Fleet^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^High Executor Anselm^Captain Harker^War is Hell^^^Speak to Bat Handler Camille at Vengeance Landing and obtain passage to the Windrunner. Report to Captain Harker aboard the ship.^We have the Windrunner
column2: the Queen's Reprisal and the Oblivion stationed just east of the Derelict Strand. Send orders to the fleet's commander
column3: Captain Harker
column4: that they're to destroy the Alliance's cannons. Speak to our bat handler
column5: Camille
column6: and ask for passage to the fleet's location. Be quick
column7: <name>
column8: every minute we spend fighting the Alliance is a minute we could've spent fighting Arthas.

column1: Ambushed!^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Captain Harker^Captain Harker^War is Hell^^^Captain Harker aboard the Windrunner wants you to kill 15 North Fleet Marines.^This should have been a walk in the park. Their forces are hungry
column2: injured and ill equipped. Yet somehow
column3: we walked right into their trap. We approached these reefs from the south to gain cover and were immediately boarded by the Alliance dogs. I'm sorry to say
column4: if you want our cannons to fire at anything
column5: you're going to have to help us take our ships back.

column1: Of Keys and Cages^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Father Levariol^Father Levariol^Of Keys and Cages^All Hail the Conqueror of Skorn!^^Father Levariol has asked you to collect enough Gjalerbron Cage Keys to free 10 Gjalerbron Prisoners. Return to him at Westguard Keep when you manage to do so.^The captain may not care
column2: but from the little we know
column3: the vrykul are conducting heinous rites in some sort of 'awakening' ritual up north in Gjalerbron. They're using living sacrifices to fuel their unholy rituals! <class>
column4: you must put a stop to this! It matters not who or what is in those cages
column5: they must be freed. I'd bet that the vrykul hold the keys. The Light knows the last thing we need is more of those strange vrykul walking about
column6: or worse yet
column7: them wakening something even more evil!

column1: Guide Our Sights^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Captain Harker^Dark Ranger Lyana^War is Hell^^^Use the Smoke Flares at the location of the Alliance Cannons on the northern wall of the Derelict Strand. Report to Dark Ranger Lyana at the Bleeding Vale after you've completed this task.^We should be able to kill our way back to our guns. Unfortunately
column2: visibility is less than desirable so you will have to mark our targets from the ground. Take these smoke flares with you and use them to mark the locations of the cannons along the northern wall in the Derelict Strand
column3: west of here
column4: where the Alliance are holding out. Let Lyana know as soon as the way is clear for the ground troops. We can take care of ourselves over here.

column1: Landing the Killing Blow^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Dark Ranger Lyana^Dark Ranger Lyana^War is Hell^^^Dark Ranger Lyana south of the Vengeance Landing wants you to kill Captain Olster
column2: Lieutenant Celeyne
column3: and Sergeant Lorric at the Derelict Strand.^You've proven yourself in the field of battle
column4: <name>. You might very well have changed the tides in our favor. I've an important assignment for you now. I'm not sure how much longer the weakness we've exposed is going to last
column5: so we must use the element of surprise to our advantage. I want you to use the confusion created by our attack and go behind enemy lines to assassinate their leaders. In order of rank
column6: they are: Captain Olster
column7: Lieutenant Celeyne and Sergeant Lorric. Good luck
column8: <class>.

column1: Report to Anselm^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Dark Ranger Lyana^High Executor Anselm^War is Hell^^A Score to Settle^Report back to High Executor Anselm at Vengeance Landing in Howling Fjord.^Let's send word back to old Anselm then. Victory has come later than expected
column2: but better late than never. Tell him it will take our forces a few hours at most to finish off the stragglers here. Glory to the Banshee Queen!

column1: Dealing With Gjalerbron^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Captain Adams^Captain Adams^Dealing With Gjalerbron^All Hail the Conqueror of Skorn!^The Slumbering King^Captain Adams has asked you to kill 15 Gjalerbron Warriors
column2: 8 Gjalerbron Rune-casters
column3: and 8 Gjalerbron Sleep-watchers. Afterward
column4: return to him at Westguard Keep.^And now we have a different problem. My scouts that have lived to return have informed me that the vrykul are up to no good at their main fortress to the north. They call the place Gjalerbron
column5: though you'd pronounce the 'Gj' as if it were an 'Sh'. Odd creatures. But that's not important; what is
column6: is that you get up there and put an end to the lives of as many of those creatures as you can while trying to figure out what they're up to. I know that I can count on you
column7: <name>.

column1: Necro Overlord Mezhen^72^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Captain Adams^Captain Adams^Dealing With Gjalerbron^^^Kill Necro Overlord Mezhen. Then
column2: return to Captain Adams at Westguard Keep.^The Scourge are at Gjalerbron and they have necromancers with them! They must be working to bring the vrykul into Arthas' fold. I want the leader of these necrolords eliminated! Do whatever it takes
column3: <name>
column4: but see to it that Necro Overlord Mezhen
column5: and whatever he's attempting to accomplish
column6: is neutralized. I will not see the vrykul successfully allied with the Scourge! Look for Mezhen on the platform in the rear right section of Gjalerbron.

column1: Gjalerbron Attack Plans^72^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Gjalerbron Attack Plans^Mage-Lieutenant Malister^Gjalerbron Attack Plans^All Hail the Conqueror of Skorn!^^Deliver the Gjalerbron Attack Plans to Mage-Lieutenant Malister at Westguard Keep.^These plans detail an imminent attack upon Westguard Keep. It would appear that the frost wyrm
column2: Glacion
column3: who circles overhead is to be used for the offensive. Surely Mage-Lieutenant Malister would be of some assistance in this matter. Deliver the plans to him at the keep to the south.

column1: The Frost Wyrm and its Master^72^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Mage-Lieutenant Malister^Mage-Lieutenant Malister^Gjalerbron Attack Plans^^^Slay Wyrmcaller Vile and use the Wyrmcaller's Horn to call down and slay Glacion. Then
column2: return with the horn to Mage-Lieutenant Malister at Westguard Keep.^You were right to bring this to me
column3: <name>. You must take help back north with you to Gjalerbron and slay that wyrm and its master
column4: Wyrmcaller Vile! Even now
column5: as we speak here
column6: the frost wyrm may be on its way. However
column7: if I'm reading these plans correctly
column8: blowing the wyrmcaller's horn on his platform
column9: outside in the rear left area of Gjalerbron
column10: will call Glacion back. When the creature lands
column11: destroy it! And <name>
column12: please bring me the horn. We wouldn't want it falling back into the wrong hands.

column1: In Service to the Light^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Father Levariol^Father Levariol^Of Keys and Cages^^Sleeping Giants^Slay 10 Deathless Watchers
column2: 4 Fearsome Horrors
column3: and 2 Putrid Wights. Afterward
column4: inform Father Levariol at Westguard Keep of your success.^Your service has been exemplary
column5: <name>
column6: but there is something that is troubling me: the Scourge. The Light cannot abide their presence
column7: and neither shall we. I hope that it is not asking you too much
column8: but I would have you return north to Gjalerbron and crush the unholy Scourge in that vile lair! Be sure to check for them in the Waking Halls beneath Gjalerbron as well. Purification is the key to salvation
column9: my child. Make us proud!

column1: Leader of the Deranged^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Sapper Steelring^Sapper Steelring^Danger! Explosives!^^My Daughter
column2: See to the Operations^Slay Squeeg Idolhunter and then report back to Sapper Steelring at Westguard Keep.^So
column3: I hate to say it
column4: pal
column5: but while you were out
column6: the captain took a keener interest in that place. Looks like he wants my old Explorers' League boss in there dead. My guess would be that we're gearing up for an offensive to clear out the rest of them
column7: and the captain wants their head lopped off
column8: as it were. Do me a favor? Head back into Whisper Gulch and put an end to Squeeg Idolhunter. From what I remember
column9: my guess would be that he's in the cave in the northwest corner.

column1: Trail of Fire^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Apothecary Hanes^Apothecary Lysander^^^^Escort Apothecary Hanes out of the Derelict Strand. Report to Apothecary Lysander at Vengeance Landing in Howling Fjord when you've completed this task.^Thanks for bailing me out of this mess
column2: <name>. I was not looking forward to what these Alliance scumbags had in store for me. Let's get out of here and see if we can get back at them somehow. Is that a campfire over there?

column1: If Valgarde Falls...^70^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Vice Admiral Keller^Vice Admiral Keller^Hell Has Frozen Over...^^^Vice Admiral Keller at Valgarde Port in the Howling Fjord wants you to slay 12 Dragonflayer Invaders or Dragonflayer Worgs.^If Valgarde falls
column2: our primary supply line into Northrend will cease to exist. From there it'll only be a matter of time before we're all servants of the Lich King. Now I don't know about you
column3: but I've got a wife and three kids back in Elwynn and I'll be damned if I'll go down without a fight. The situation here is critical and we can use all the manpower you're able to muster. Get to the front gate and help the guards defend the city against the invading monsters!

column1: Rescuing the Rescuers^70^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Vice Admiral Keller^Vice Admiral Keller^Hell Has Frozen Over...^^Fresh Legs
column2: Into Utgarde!
column3: The Human League
column4: The Shining Light
column5: Into the World of Spirits
column6: The Path to Payback^Vice Admiral Keller at Valgarde Port in the Howling Fjord wants you to rescue 8 Valgarde Scouts that have been impaled and left for dead.^We'd been here for a month when those malformed giants appeared out of thin air. We were ill-prepared for any sort of attack and paid dearly for our complacency. An entire archaeology team was lost and several townsfolk were abducted and taken to the ruins. We've been on the defensive ever since. To make matters worse
column7: the scouts we sent to rescue our people have been harpooned by the vrykul and left for dead in the forest directly north of Valgarde. Dislodge those harpoons and free our scouts!

column1: Towers of Certain Doom^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Westguard Sergeant^Westguard Sergeant^^Operation: Skornful Wrath^All Hail the Conqueror of Skorn!^The Westguard Sergeant has informed you that using the Sergeant's Flare to target all four of the towers at Skorn for cannon volleys would be advisable.^<Sir /Ma'am>
column2: as we move through Skorn
column3: we have to bring down those towers! If you have a look at them
column4: you'll notice that their tops are lined with casters. Getting too close to them would mean certain doom for us! However
column5: we do have it within our means to call in cannon volleys from Westguard Keep. To do so
column6: we need to get close enough so that you can lob a smoke flare atop of them. Just don't get too close!

column1: Gruesome
column2: But Necessary^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Westguard Sergeant^Westguard Sergeant^^Operation: Skornful Wrath^All Hail the Conqueror of Skorn!^The Westguard Sergeant has asked you to use The Sergeant's Machete to dismember 20 Vrykul of the Winterskorn tribe at Skorn.^We've had reports that these vrykul can rise from the dead; not unlike the Scourge
column3: but a different kind of undeath. Let's not take any chances. Here
column4: take my machete. As we move through this place
column5: you'll need to carve up the remains of the vrykul that we take down. I'd do it
column6: but I have a sensitive stomach. <The sergeant smirks.> I spent all morning sharpening it
column7: so it should do the job.

column1: Burn Skorn
column2: Burn!^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Westguard Sergeant^Westguard Sergeant^^Operation: Skornful Wrath^All Hail the Conqueror of Skorn!^The Westguard Sergeant has orders that you should use the Sergeant's Torch to set fire to the Northeast and Northwest Longhouses and the Barracks at Skorn.^Captain Adams gave me strict instructions to make sure that a good deal of infrastructure damage was inflicted on this site. However
column3: since you're in charge out here
column4: that's at your discretion
column5: <sir /ma'am>. May I suggest that we burn down the two longhouses and the barracks that are in the lower area of Skorn? All we have to do is get inside each and throw this torch.

column1: Operation: Skornful Wrath^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Captain Adams^Westguard Sergeant^Absholutely... Thish Will Work!^^Towers of Certain Doom
column2: Gruesome
column3: But Necessary
column4: Burn Skorn
column5: Burn!
column6: Stop the Ascension!^Captain Adams has asked you to use the Westguard Command Insignia at Skorn
column7: and then to speak with the Westguard Sergeant.^<name>
column8: I must now ask you to undertake an operation so hazardous
column9: so deadly
column10: that only you can see it through. The vrykul fortress
column11: Skorn
column12: sits on our eastern border. My scouts inform me that those 'giants' are poised to strike us
column13: and with my forces scattered all over the fjord
column14: I don't have the men to take the place by force. Instead
column15: you're going to use your cunning. I've sent a sergeant ahead with the details. Show this command insignia at Skorn and he'll reveal himself and follow your orders.

column1: Stop the Ascension!^72^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Vrykul Scroll of Ascension^Father Levariol^^Operation: Skornful Wrath^^Present the Vrykul Scroll of Ascension near the Thane's Pyre to call him out and slay him. Afterward
column2: due to the nature of the ritual
column3: you're sure that Father Levariol at Westguard Keep will be interested in seeing the scroll.^This huge scroll is made from dragon skin. Unfurling its more-than-ten-foot length
column4: you can see that the images painted upon its scaly surface depict a mysterious vrykul ritual. A vrykul thane
column5: surrounded by angelic-looking beings
column6: ascends into the heavens. A mysterious
column7: darkened figure looms large in the picture's background. A tingling in your gut tells you that the thane of Skorn is about to do this. You must stop it! A large pyre sits at the top of Skorn in front of the thane's lodge.

column1: All Hail the Conqueror of Skorn!^72^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Westguard Sergeant^Captain Adams^^Towers of Certain Doom
column2: Gruesome
column3: But Necessary
column4: Burn Skorn
column5: Burn!^Of Keys and Cages
column6: Dealing With Gjalerbron
column7: Gjalerbron Attack Plans
column8: Down to the Wire
column9: I'll Try Anything!
column10: Everything Must Be Ready^Return the Westguard Command Insignia to Captain Adams at Westguard Keep.^We -- well
column11: you -- have done everything that we were sent here to accomplish <sir /ma'am>. I must say that it's been a pleasure taking orders from such a fine
column12: young <race>. The captain is sure to want to hear of your success
column13: but if you decide to stay out here for whatever reason

column1: Fresh Legs^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Scout Valory^Defender Mordun^Fresh Legs^Rescuing the Rescuers^^Scout Valory wants you to investigate the sounds of battle coming from the northeast of Wyrmskull Village.^It's come at great cost
column2: but we've completed our inspection of the site. The news isn't good. Nearly everyone has been slain or captured. Only a few veteran guards remain unaccounted for. The scouts have done all we can here. You must pick up where we've left off. Sounds of a skirmish are coming from up the hill to the northeast. Have a look
column3: <class>. We can only hope there are some who have survived
column4: and that they may have some intel we can use against this enemy.

column1: Into Utgarde!^71^Alliance^Utgarde Keep^Defender Mordun^Vice Admiral Keller^Fresh Legs^Rescuing the Rescuers^^Defender Mordun has tasked you with the execution of Ingvar the Plunderer who resides deep in Utgarde.^Listen up
column2: youngster. I've put down me share of these creatures - and your share too fer that matter. Here be what ya need to know.... The vrykul are fearless in a fight. Seems they actually yearn fer a death in battle. With their numbers and that ferocity
column3: we're doomed - plain and simple. There's one they esteem though
column4: goes by the name of Ingvar. I dunno why they be seekin' his praise
column5: but bring him down and you'll deal a mighty blow to their spirit. Then
column6: perhaps
column7: we'll have a chance....

column1: Sniff Out the Enemy^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Pontius^Dragonskin Scroll^Let Them Eat Crow^^^Use the Plaguehound Leash near the plaguehound cages at Vengeance Landing and look for clues at the location you're led to by the Plaguehound Tracker.^Now that this rascal's belly's full
column2: maybe he will be more willing to cooperate. Here's his leash
column3: just come get him from his cage whenever you're ready to take him. I don't know what Anselm expects you to find
column4: but look for clues wherever it is that the dog takes you.

column1: The Dragonskin Map^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Dragonskin Scroll^High Executor Anselm^Let Them Eat Crow^^^Bring the Dragonskin Map to High Executor Anselm in Vengeance Landing.^Upon closer inspection
column2: the scroll appears to be a heavily-illustrated map of the fjord. The location of various villages are depicted in what seem to be tribal symbols. The location of Vengeance Landing is marked with a disproportionately large skull. This map will almost certainly be of military value to High Executor Anselm.

column1: Prisoners of Wyrmskull^70^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Vice Admiral Keller^Vice Admiral Keller^Hell Has Frozen Over...^^^Vice Admiral Keller at Valgarde Port in the Howling Fjord wants you to rescue 3 Captured Valgarde Prisoners.^This battle is far from over
column2: <name>. If our people are still alive inside that village
column3: someone has to go and get 'em. <Vice Admiral Keller nods at you.> Head north and enter Wyrmskull Village. Once there
column4: look for our people. If they are imprisoned you'll need to find a way to break them out. Maybe they'll have some more information about what it is that we're actually fighting.

column1: Skorn Must Fall!^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Chieftain Ashtotem^Winterhoof Brave^^Mimicking Nature's Call^Gruesome
column2: But Necessary
column3: Burn Skorn
column4: Burn!
column5: Towers of Certain Doom
column6: Stop the Ascension!^Chieftain Ashtotem has asked you to use the Winterhoof Emblem at Skorn
column7: and then to speak with the Winterhoof Brave.^<name>
column8: the vrykul fortress
column9: Skorn
column10: sits to the south. Its strange giants have recently awakened and have begun to spread
column11: attacking us wherever they can. My scouts inform me that they are poised to strike at us here
column12: but I do not have the strength to repel such a force. Instead
column13: we will prepare to leave north to less dangerous lands. I ask that you use your cunning to buy us time. I've sent a brave ahead with the details. Show this emblem at Skorn and he'll reveal himself and do all he can to aid you.

column1: The Conqueror of Skorn!^72^Horde^Howling Fjord^Winterhoof Brave^Chieftain Ashtotem^The Conqueror of Skorn!^Gruesome
column2: But Necessary
column3: Burn Skorn
column4: Burn!

column6: Find Sage Mistwalker^Return the Winterhoof Token to Chieftain Ashtotem at Camp Winterhoof.^You have done everything that we were sent here to do
column7: <class>. I must admit that you fight well. Your people are not as strange as I first thought. Chieftain Ashtotem is certain to want to hear of your success
column8: but if you decide to stay out here for whatever reason
column9: I will continue to fight at your side.

column1: Ingvar Must Die!^71^Horde^Utgarde Keep^Dark Ranger Marrah^High Executor Anselm^^^^Dark Ranger Marrah has asked you to kill Ingvar the Plunderer in Utgarde Keep
column2: then bring his head to High Executor Anselm at Vengeance Landing.^Finally
column3: someone's come. I've been here far too long and my wits are beginning to fail me. Of our entire recon party
column4: only I remain. I shall give you my report and it will be up to you to act upon the information. Know this
column5: <class>; it did not come cheaply. These vrykul are relentless fighters. Given their numbers and their savage tactics
column6: our only hope is to bring down their leader and pray it brings chaos to their ranks. Ingvar is his name. Bring his head to Anselm when your duty is done.

column1: Dealing With Gjalerbron^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Chieftain Ashtotem^Chieftain Ashtotem^The Conqueror of Skorn!^^The Slumbering King^Chieftain Ashtotem has asked you to kill 15 Gjalerbron Warriors
column2: 8 Gjalerbron Rune-casters
column3: and 8 Gjalerbron Sleep-watchers. Afterward
column4: return to him at Camp Winterhoof.^My longrunners that have lived to return have informed me that the vrykul have awakened at their main fortress to the west. It is a forbidden place known as Gjalerbron. The longrunners tell me that the vrykul are performing strange rituals. We cannot allow this to continue. Are you willing to continue to assist us? Will you kill the vrykul at Gjalerbron before they finish whatever they are doing and attack us here?

column1: Necro Overlord Mezhen^72^Horde^Howling Fjord^Chieftain Ashtotem^Chieftain Ashtotem^The Conqueror of Skorn!^^^Kill Necro Overlord Mezhen. Then
column2: return to Chieftain Ashtotem at Camp Winterhoof.^The dead ones are at Gjalerbron and they have necromancers with them? We must eliminate the leader of these necrolords. Do whatever it takes
column3: <name>
column4: but see to it that Necro Overlord Mezhen
column5: and whatever he's attempting to accomplish
column6: is neutralized. We cannot afford to see the vrykul successful in whatever they are doing with these undead creatures! Look for Mezhen on the platform in the rear right section of Gjalerbron.

column1: Of Keys and Cages^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Greatmother Ankha^Greatmother Ankha^Of Keys and Cages^Stop the Ascension!^Sleeping Giants^Greatmother Ankha has asked you to collect enough Gjalerbron Cage Keys to free 10 Gjalerbron Prisoners. Return to her at Camp Winterhoof when you manage to do so.^From the little we know
column2: the vrykul are conducting unnatural rites in an 'awakening' ritual to the west in Gjalerbron. They're using living sacrifices to fuel their rituals. <name>
column3: you must stop this. It matters not who or what is in those cages
column4: they must be freed. I would guess that the vrykul hold the keys. The last thing we need is more of those strange vrykul threatening us
column5: or worse
column6: them wakening something even more evil....

column1: Gjalerbron Attack Plans^72^Horde^Howling Fjord^Gjalerbron Attack Plans^Celea Frozenmane^Gjalerbron Attack Plans^The Conqueror of Skorn!^^Deliver the Gjalerbron Attack Plans to Celea Frozenmane at Camp Winterhoof.^These plans detail an imminent attack upon Camp Winterhoof. It would appear that the frost wyrm
column2: Glacion
column3: who circles overhead
column4: is to be used for the offensive. Surely Celea Frozenmane would be of some assistance in this matter. Deliver the plans to her at the camp to the east.

column1: The Frost Wyrm and its Master^72^Horde^Howling Fjord^Celea Frozenmane^Celea Frozenmane^Gjalerbron Attack Plans^^^Slay Wyrmcaller Vile and use the Wyrmcaller's Horn to call down and slay Glacion. Then
column2: return with the horn to Celea Frozenmane at Camp Winterhoof.^Your instincts were right to bring this to me
column3: but my wind riders cannot fight a dragon. You must take help back west with you to Gjalerbron and slay the frost wyrm and its master
column4: Wyrmcaller Vile! Even now it may be on its way! If I'm reading these plans correctly
column5: blowing the wyrmcaller's horn on his platform
column6: outside in the rear left area of Gjalerbron
column7: will call Glacion back. When the creature lands
column8: destroy it! And <name>
column9: bring me the horn. We wouldn't want it falling back into the wrong hands!

column1: The Walking Dead^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Greatmother Ankha^Greatmother Ankha^Of Keys and Cages^^^Slay 10 Deathless Watchers
column2: 4 Fearsome Horrors
column3: and 2 Putrid Wights. Afterward
column4: inform Greatmother Ankha at Camp Winterhoof of your success.^Your assistance to us has been tremendous
column5: <name>
column6: but there is something that is troubling me: these so-called Scourge. The spirits of the land and air
column7: the waters and the fire below the world
column8: would not abide their presence
column9: but seem to do nothing about them. We will see to it that they are dealt with! Perhaps it is asking too much
column10: but I would have you return west to Gjalerbron and destroy the unnatural Scourge in that vile lair. Be sure to check in the Waking Halls below Gjalerbron as well!

column1: Down to the Wire^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Gil Grisert^Gil Grisert^Down to the Wire^All Hail the Conqueror of Skorn!^^Gil Grisert wants you to bring him 10 clumps of Spotted Hippogryph Down.^The vanguard of the Alliance force will be arriving within days. The soldiers will be expecting their winter gear to be prepared
column2: but I've still got more cloaks to make. I've been using spotted hippogryph down for the cloaks' linings
column3: but my stock won't last! You've got to help me
column4: <name>. Captain Adams will have my hide if those cloaks aren't ready in time! Bring me all the down you can find out there. It's dropped to the ground by molting hippogryphs flying over the wilderness around the fort.

column1: War is Hell^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^High Executor Anselm^High Executor Anselm^War is Hell^^^High Executor Anselm at Vengeance Landing wants you to take the Burning Torch and use it to burn 10 of the corpses littered to the west of town.^We're slowly finishing off the remnants of Stormwind's North Fleet stationed on this coast. The bodies to the west are a testament to how brutal this confrontation has been. This does not happen to bother my refined aesthetics
column2: but it does present a danger to our lives. In the lands of the Lich King
column3: the dead are a weapon that can rise against us at any point in time. Take this torch - you're going to make sure that doesn't happen.

column1: Hasty Preparations^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Ahota Whitefrost^Ahota Whitefrost^^^^Ahota Whitefrost at Camp Winterhoof wants you to bring him 10 clumps of Spotted Hippogryph Down.^The down of the spotted hippogryph is prized by my people and used for everything from fletching to ceremonial clothing. We're making preparations to leave the post
column2: so this is the last chance I'll get to gather it this season. With your help
column3: I'll have enough to make sure everyone has the equipment they need for the long trek into the hills. Conditions worsen very quickly up there and a storm can blow in without warning. The down can be found all over the ground in the area surrounding the post.

column1: A Score to Settle^71^Horde^Utgarde Keep^High Executor Anselm^High Executor Anselm^^Report to Anselm^^High Executor Anselm wants you to to go into Utgarde and slay Prince Keleseth.^This elf prince thinks he can come to my town
column2: insult my queen
column3: kill my men and get away with it? He thinks we're going to stand by while the hordes of Utgarde build up to launch an attack? Not in a million years. You're going to walk right into Utgarde and kill him in front of any of these vrykul gorillas that might be watching. I want Arthas to know that we've arrived and we're playing for keeps.

column1: The Human League^70^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Beltrand McSorf^Pulroy the Archaeologist^The Human League^Rescuing the Rescuers^^Search Wyrmskull Village for Pulroy.^We were on the brink of an archaeological breakthrough when those monsters attacked! Sadly
column2: I was the only one to make it back to Valgarde. Now I don't know if my crew is dead or alive
column3: but the artifacts we uncovered on that dig must be found! If you're heading into Wyrmskull Village
column4: will you keep an eye out for my team? If there's any hope of recovering that information
column5: we must pursue it! Search for Pulroy first. He was the last one I saw before I made my escape.

column1: Zedd's Probably Dead^70^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Pulroy the Archaeologist^Zedd^The Human League^^^Search Wyrmskull Village for Zedd.^To whomever finds this journal: These bloodthirsty monsters have taken up residence in the ruins of Wyrmskull. What they want or why they're here is a mystery. In any case
column2: the artifacts are not safe with those beast-men around. Zedd and I made a new discovery while hiding out: a cipher to decode the tablets! Unfortunately Zedd and I were separated late last night. He had the cipher. Tablets were with Glorenfeld and Daegarn. Location unknown... Find Zedd. -Pulroy

column1: Making the Horn^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Nokoma Snowseer^Nokoma Snowseer^Making the Horn^^Suppressing the Elements
column2: The Book of Runes
column3: March of the Giants^Nokoma Snowseer at Camp Winterhoof wants you to bring her 6 Undamaged Ram Horns.^My people have been hunting the giant yeti of these hills for generations and I will be participating for the first time this year. It will probably be the last before we leave the post forever. To prepare for the hunt
column4: I must fashion a loud horn from the horns of the dire rams that roam the snowy areas near our camp. The elders tell me the sound mimics the mating call of the female yeti
column5: but I have my doubts. Bring me the best dire ram horns you can find
column6: <name>
column7: and I'll select one from among them.

column1: And Then There Were Two...^70^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Zedd^Glorenfeld^The Human League^^^Search the Utgarde Catacombs for Glorenfeld.^There's no sign of the cipher on Zedd. After carefully searching the area you discover some writing in the dirt: "Glor and Dae inside catacombs. Have cipher and tablets." Perhaps you should head into the catacombs located just north of here and search for Glorenfeld and Daegarn. The bridge crossing the worg pit will lead you right to the tunnel leading down into the catacombs.

The Depths of Depravity^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Glorenfeld^Glorenfeld^The Human League^^^Glorenfeld at the Utgarde Catacombs wants you to collect 10 Wyrmskull Tablets.^They're keepin' Daegarn locked up in a cage at the large fightin' ring nearby. From what I've gathered
column2: the Dragonflayers bring out their prisoners to battle against their most powerful gladiators. They dump the losers in the basement where Scourge necromancers turn 'em into ghoulies! It's horrifying! But first things first! The tablets are strewn about all across this dungeon. Let's get those recovered before you go off tryin' to be a hero.

column1: Return to Valgarde^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Glorenfeld^Beltrand McSorf^The Human League^^Trust is Earned
column2: Out of My Element?
column3: Outpost Over Yonder...^Take Glorenfeld's Package to Beltrand McSorf at Valgarde Port.^Tis a shame we lost two of our best dwarves while uncovering these relics. They sacrificed their lives to keep this information safe. <Glorenfeld wraps the cipher and tablets in a tattered cloth.> Take these back to Valgarde. McSorf will know what to do with the find. As for me? I'll be alright on my own. I've gotten this far in one piece!

column1: Green Eggs and Whelps^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Plaguebringer Tillinghast^Plaguebringer Tillinghast^Green Eggs and Whelps^^^Plaguebringer Tillinghast has asked you to collect 10 Plagued Proto-Whelp Specimens and deliver them to him at New Agamand.^This new plague that we're working on is wonderful and I think we should expand its testing. How about testing it on proto-whelps?! Just think of the possibilities. The ability to infect not only humanoids
column2: but extend our reach to any creature! Here
column3: I've hoarded an extra plague canister for the right time and place
column4: and you look like the right person. Spray the eggs at Ember Clutch to the northwest
column5: then get specimens from the plagued proto-whelps that hatch.

column1: Draconis Gastritis^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Plaguebringer Tillinghast^Plaguebringer Tillinghast^Green Eggs and Whelps^^^Plaguebringer Tillinghast at New Agamand wants you to use Tillinghast's Plagued Meat to attract down a Proto-Drake and observe its reaction to eating the stuff.^Wait
column2: that gives me an idea! What if it didn't kill the whelps because it was sprayed on the outside of their eggs? <name>
column3: we have to get the plague inside of them! I know! I've got some plagued meat here. Take it to the Ember Clutch and get them to eat it! But no
column4: we're thinking too small. Let's get one of the proto-drakes flying overhead to come down and eat it. Yes! Stay close to the meat and observe what happens. Yes
column5: it might attack you
column6: but such is the price of progress.

column1: Mimicking Nature's Call^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Nokoma Snowseer^Nokoma Snowseer^Making the Horn^^Skorn Must Fall!^Test the Carved Horn and then return to Nokoma Snowseer at Camp Winterhoof with the results.^The horn has been roughed out
column2: but before I make the traditional carvings
column3: I want to be certain that it will work. Ahota tells me that he tests his horns at the foot of the frozen waterfall to the northeast of the post. Ahota tells me that our hunters have used the acoustics of frozen water in this way for generations. I can't wait to learn more! Will you help me test out the horn? If I've done everything right
column4: you may even attract a yeti
column5: so be prepared! Bring the horn back once you've tested it.

column1: A Lesson in Fear^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Sergeant Gorth^Sergeant Gorth^Let Them Eat Crow^^Baleheim Bodycount
column2: Baleheim Must Burn!^Gorth wants you to kill Ulf the Bloodletter
column3: Oric the Baleful and Gunnar Thorvardsson and drive the Forsaken Banner through their corpses. Slay Vrykul across the Forsaken blockade until they appear.^When you've been in lots of fight like Gorth
column4: you learn that to beat enemy good you have to make them really scared to die! But these vrykuls not afraid. You kill one and another comes... screaming louder and with a bigger weapon than the one before. Only thing that makes vrykuls afraid is when we kill the biggest and baddest vrykul of all. Go fight the Winterskorn across the blockade until hero vrykuls show up! Then you kill them dead and put queen's flag on corpses. They must learn to fear!

column1: Baleheim Bodycount^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Sergeant Gorth^Sergeant Gorth^^A Lesson in Fear^The Ambush^Sergeant Gorth wants you to kill 16 Winterskorn Vrykul inside Baleheim.^Them vrykuls just keeps coming and coming out from town west of here. No end in sight! Gorth has an idea. You go INSIDE town and kill them Winterskorn there. THEN they stop coming here!
The Yeti Next Door^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Foreman Colbey^Foreman Colbey^^^The Enigmatic Frost Nymphs
column2: The Book of Runes
column3: March of the Giants^Foreman Colbey at Fort Wildervar wants you to defeat Shatterhorn.^Maybe if the sentries won't help me
column4: you will? I'm the foreman of the mine just across the bridge. My men are mining ore for the weapons our expeditionary force will need to carve a path into the Grizzly Hills. A giant yeti has invaded the mine
column5: blocking the tunnel we need to expand! We've tried yelling at him and smoking him out
column6: but nothing's worked. Maybe you could rouse it from its sleep with a meal of meat from the frosthorn rams in the snowy areas around town? Please? We're desperate!

column1: Baleheim Must Burn!^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Sergeant Gorth^Sergeant Gorth^^A Lesson in Fear^The Ambush^Sergeant Gorth wants you to go to Baleheim and use Gorth's Torch to burn 1 Winterskorn Dwelling
column2: 1 Winterskorn Watchtower
column3: 1 Winterskorn Bridge and 1 Winterskorn Barracks.^Killing the Winterskorns maybe not enough. Maybe we burn their houses too! Uh... and their bridges. We should burn whole town to be safe! You take this torch. Go to Baleheim
column4: to the west
column5: and burn EVERYTHING! That teach them good.

column1: The Artifacts of Steel Gate^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Sage Mistwalker^Sage Mistwalker^Find Sage Mistwalker^^^Sage Mistwalker has asked you to collect 10 Steel Gate Artifacts. When you have all of them
column2: return to him at Steel Gate.^I came out here for a different reason; an old friend of mine has been calling to me in my dreams. But now that I see these small things with their machines making a big hole in the ground
column3: it makes my blood boil. From what I can see
column4: these dwarves
column5: as they are known
column6: are digging up artifacts; artifacts that could be important to our past. I want you to go down there and get these things for me. Don't let any of those dwarves stand in your way.

column1: Find Sage Mistwalker^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Greatmother Ankha^Sage Mistwalker^Find Sage Mistwalker^The Conqueror of Skorn!^^Greatmother Ankha has asked you to check on the condition of Sage Mistwalker. She believes him to be at or near Steel Gate.^<class>
column2: I grow worried that my son
column3: Sage Mistwalker
column4: has been gone for such a long time. The land is cruel and deadly. He spoke of a recurring vision that he had of a wolf
column5: and went west with a small group of longrunners to seek its source. I believe the name of the place he mentioned was Steel Gate. Will you find him? I want to make sure that no ill has befallen him.

column1: The Shining Light^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Ares the Oathbound^Ares the Oathbound^The Shining Light^Rescuing the Rescuers^^Ares the Oathbound in the Utgarde Catacombs wants you to recover the Sacred Artifact.^<Ares gasps for air as he tries to speak.> I am an envoy of the Argent Crusade
column2: charged with a sacred duty. Our forces were decimated in the Plaguelands. By the light of dawn
column3: the artifact was cleansed and made pure once more. So many perished in the wake of its redemption. There is still a chance... still time. The artifact was hurled into the den of the fallen
column4: far below us. Guarded by the unmerciful dead. <Ares' body glows with blinding light.> Light. Will. Protect. You.

column1: Guided by Honor^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Ares the Oathbound^Lord Irulon Trueblade^The Shining Light^^^Return the Sacred Artifact to Lord Irulon Trueblade at Valgarde.^<Ares smiles.> Glory to the Light. You have done it! <Ares coughs.> Take the artifact and return it to Valgarde. Lord Irulon Trueblade awaits its return. Fight with honor
column2: friend. Always. Honor. <Ares dies.>

column1: Dragonflayer Battle Plans^70^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Vice Admiral Keller^Vice Admiral Keller^Hell Has Frozen Over...^^^Vice Admiral Keller at Valgarde Port in the Howling Fjord has asked that you bring him the Dragonflayer Battle Plans.^While we were able to gather very little information as to the whereabouts of Ingvar
column2: we do know that Yanis resides in a cave next to the worg pit inside Wyrmskull Village. Intelligence gathered from the rescued soldiers indicates that Yanis guards Dragonflayer battle plans. I need you to go back to Wyrmskull and recover those plans. Kill any vrykul that get in your way - including Yanis!

column1: To Westguard Keep!^70^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Vice Admiral Keller^Captain Adams^Hell Has Frozen Over...^^^Take the Dragonflayer Battle Plans to Captain Adams at Westguard Keep in the Howling Fjord.^<Vice Admiral Keller rolls up the battle plans.> We've got all the information we need to keep Valgarde protected. You must take these battle plans to Westguard Keep
