column2: located on the western fjord cliff wall. Speak with the flight master assistant
column3: Emilune Winterwind. She will put you on the back of a gryphon headed towards Westguard. Once there
column4: find Captain Adams. He's the one in charge. Adams will know what to do with these plans.

column1: Preying Upon the Weak^70^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Trapper Jethan^Trapper Jethan^^Everything Must Be Ready^^Trapper Jethan at Fort Wildervar wants you to bring him 8 pieces of Trapped Prey.^Glad to meet you. I've come here from the Grizzly Hills to do business with your cohorts. My people maintain a large outpost there
column2: and you'd do well to visit it when you head north. I've set up traps in the woodlands and snowy areas around here. With the meat and the furs from the creatures they capture
column3: I'll have plenty to barter with the townspeople. I can offer you a share of my profits if you're willing to help gather prey from the traps. Beware though
column4: you won't be the only predator out there.

column1: The Offensive Begins^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^High Executor Anselm^Sergeant Gorth^Let Them Eat Crow^^^Speak to Sergeant Gorth at the blockade near the elevator west of Vengeance Landing in Howling Fjord.^No one seems to know very much about the vrykul. Our records show no signs of activity in their lands for centuries. Yet here they are
column2: just as we move against Arthas. The map you retrieved makes it clear that we'll have to defeat them if our forces are to get any further into Northrend. One of my best sergeants
column3: an abomination known as Gorth
column4: oversees the blockade beyond the lift. Assist him in launching a pre-emptive strike on Baleheim. If a vrykul attack occurs
column5: it will be launched from there.

column1: Rivenwood Captives^72^Horde^Howling Fjord^Longrunner Skycloud^Longrunner Skycloud^^^^Longrunner Skycloud has asked you to free his 7 Winterhoof Longrunners. Once you have managed to do so
column2: return to him at Steel Gate.^Something
column3: most likely the walking dead known as the Scourge
column4: has agitated the creatures hereabouts. While escorting the sage here
column5: we lost most of our hunting force to the riven widows -- huge and deadly spiders
column6: which inhabit the Rivenwood to the north. I must stay here to protect the small force we have left
column7: but you... you could see if my longrunners are still alive
column8: trapped within the riven widow's cocoons. Would you do this
column9: stranger?

column1: Keeping Watch on the Interlopers^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Junat the Wanderer^Apothecary Malthus^Keeping Watch on the Interlopers^Suppressing the Elements^^Speak to Apothecary Malthus at the Apothecary Camp.^Even the earth cannot hold back the tide of death washing over it. Corpses walk the land
column2: spreading their putrefaction with alarming speed. A small expedition has made its way up the western cliffs and rests near Whisper Gulch. Take a look for yourself
column3: <name>. See if you can learn their purpose and dissuade them from bringing their poisons into our lands. Travel southwest from the post
column4: toward the cliffs overlooking the western beach. Their camp will be west of the excavation at Steel Gate.

column1: What's in That Brew?^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Apothecary Malthus^Apothecary Malthus^Keeping Watch on the Interlopers^^^Apothecary Malthus at the Apothecary Camp wants you to bring him 5 Dwarven Kegs.^To the southeast is an area called Whisper Gulch. It's overrun with members of the Explorers' League who've gone mad! They attacked our caravan as it passed through the area
column2: and they've harried our foraging parties as well. I must know what's causing this madness! I suspect that whatever they're drinking from the kegs scattered around the gulch contributes to their insanity. I want you to steal the kegs from those dwarves while they're busy mining away.

column1: The Ring of Judgement^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Glorenfeld^Daegarn^The Human League^^^Find Daegarn in the Ring of Judgement located inside the Utgarde Catacombs.^You might have already seen the room where Daegarn is being held while you were gatherin' the tablets. It's through this corridor and then down a set of steps. Daegarn will be in the room at the bottom of the steps - locked up tight! Get down there and find him. At the very least you might be able to get the cipher from him.

Stunning Defeat at the Ring^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Daegarn^Glorenfeld^The Human League^^^Defeat the gladiators at the Ring of Judgement and face Oluf the Violent. Defeat Oluf and recover the Ancient Cipher.^Oluf will come out if you defeat the other gladiators. That's 'bout the only way we're getting' that cipher back. Put on your whompin' boots and get busy in the Ring of Judgement. If you do manage to get the cipher back
column2: return it to Glorenfeld o'er near the entrance to these catacombs. Me? Don't worry about me! We're on the brink of discovering the missing link to human-kind!

column1: Brains! Brains! Brains!^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Apothecary Grick^Apothecary Grick^^^^Apothecary Grick at the Apothecary Camp wants you to bring him 12 Deranged Explorer Brains.^Has Malthus drawn you in with his blather about beer kegs and crazy dwarves? I'm not questioning that the dwarves are crazy
column2: but I don't think stealing their beer is going to do any good. What we need is brains. Lots of brains. We'll get down to the bottom of this mystery in no time
column3: and perhaps even find a new component for the plague. Take this saw
column4: go southeast into the Whisper Gulch
column5: and kill yourself some dwarves. Use the saw to help you harvest the brains and bring them back here.

column1: The Enigmatic Frost Nymphs^70^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Lieutenant Maeve^Lurielle^The Enigmatic Frost Nymphs^The Yeti Next Door^Spirits of the Ice^Speak with Lurielle at the Frozen Glade.^When we first scouted locations for the fort
column2: we encountered hostile creatures at two of the glades here in the north. When we passed the snow-covered one directly south of the town
column3: the dryads there watched us with interest
column4: but did not attack. We were tired and worn down by the weather. They could've easily killed several of our men
column5: but they didn't. Perhaps
column6: in reaching out to them
column7: we might discover unexpected allies. Are you willing to travel to the Frozen Glade and make contact with them?

column1: The Ambush^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Sergeant Gorth^Lydell^The Ambush^Baleheim Bodycount
column2: Baleheim Must Burn!^^Speak to Lydell at Lydell's Ambush.^The vrykuls in Baleheim is completely defeated
column3: no doubt about it. But still their leader stays in town and won't give up. Gorth sends Lydell and his assassins to make good ambush to the northwest. You talk to Lydell and figure out how to get Vrykul chieftain to come out. Then you kill him. You kill him real good.

column1: New Agamand^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Apothecary Lysander^Chief Plaguebringer Harris^New Agamand^Test at Sea^^Bring Lysander's Strain to Chief Plaguebringer Harris in New Agamand in western Howling Fjord.^I'm afraid our equipment isn't exactly the best here at Vengeance Landing. After all it's a military controlled outpost. I will need you to take a sample of this strain to Chief Plaguebringer Harris in New Agamand
column2: follow the road beyond Baleheim south and then west. They have better equipment there - he will know what to do. You must hurry
column3: <name>. Our enemies are stronger and more numerous than us. We need to develop a viable weapon against them!

column1: A Tailor-Made Formula^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Chief Plaguebringer Harris^Chief Plaguebringer Harris^New Agamand^^^Obtain the Dragonflayer Patriarch's Blood from Thorvald at Thorvald's Camp and bring it to Chief Plaguebringer Harris in New Agamand.^We've been spraying down the vrykul village of Halgrind for weeks now and the vrykul just won't drop dead. Let's face it
column2: <name>
column3: by now our Plague has been exposed to humans
column4: dwarves
column5: dogs
column6: livestock... you name it. As our strains adapt to their hosts
column7: more impurities get thrown in the mix. What we need is a strain made custom for the vrykul's biology. Halgrind's chieftain fled the town after we took it over; you'll find him west of here. As a patriarch of the Dragonflayer clan
column8: his blood is ideal.

column1: Apply Heat and Stir^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Chief Plaguebringer Harris^Chief Plaguebringer Harris^New Agamand^^^Fill the Empty Apothecary's Flask at the Cauldron of Vrykul Blood
column2: then mix the Flask of Vrykul Blood with Harris's Plague Samples nearby until you've obtained a Balanced Concoction.^You've done well so far
column3: <name>. I'd like to teach you some of my more advanced techniques
column4: so that you gain a better understanding of the plague. Take this empty flask and fill it with blood from the cauldron to my left. Mix it with the plague samples to my right until you obtain a well balanced mix.

column1: Field Test^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Chief Plaguebringer Harris^Chief Plaguebringer Harris^New Agamand^^^Venture into Halgrind and use the Plague Spray on 10 Plagued Dragonflayer Vrykul. Return to Chief Plaguebringer Harris to report the results.^Now that we have a strain of the plague that has adapted to vrykul carriers
column2: we really ought to test it on our specimens in Halgrind. If all goes according to plan
column3: they will disintegrate immediately as the plague devours their innards! You will find Halgrind north of here. Our plaguebringers are deploying the previous strain there - shouldn't be hard to spot.

column1: Time for Cleanup^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Chief Plaguebringer Harris^"Hacksaw" Jenny^New Agamand^^^Speak to "Hacksaw" Jenny in New Agamand.^Being the practical man that I am
column2: I'm going to declare our research here a success. After all
column3: what army can't be stopped by turning its rank and file against each other? I will send word of our achievements to Vengeance Landing soon enough. But first I need you to take care of cleaning up our experimentation site. See "Hacksaw" Jenny about making you a custom abomination. One packing some explosive power if you catch my drift.

column1: Parts for the Job^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^"Hacksaw" Jenny^"Hacksaw" Jenny^New Agamand^^^"Hacksaw" Jenny in New Agamand wants you to obtain 6 Shoveltusk Ligaments and 1 Fresh Pound of Flesh.^So Harris wants a demolition job
column2: eh? Yeah
column3: I can help out. You're gonna have to get me some parts
column4: though. I can't afford to use up my choice components on something that's gonna get blown up. First of all
column5: I'm going to need shoveltusk ligaments... way better than the human kind. I will also need a pound of flesh. A fellow known as Anton sells cheap meat. He travels up and down the road to the west.

column1: Warning: Some Assembly Required^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^"Hacksaw" Jenny^"Hacksaw" Jenny^New Agamand^^^Use the Abomination Assembly Kit in Halgrind and round up plagued Vrykul with your Mindless Abomination. Slay at least 20 and return to "Hacksaw" Jenny in New Agamand when you're done.^Well
column2: here you are! Our friend's going to be somewhat... unstable. So I suggest not putting him together until reaching Halgrind. Once you're there
column3: use the abomination to round up as many vrykul as you can before self-destructing. Come back with whatever's left once you're done. I can always use more body parts!

column1: Suppressing the Elements^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Wind Tamer Kagan^Wind Tamer Kagan^^Making the Horn^Keeping Watch on the Interlopers^Wind Tamer Kagan at Camp Winterhoof wants you to kill 8 mountain elementals. You may kill either Howling Cyclones or Iceshard Elementals.^If you are to survive here
column2: as we have
column3: you must learn to face the environment's challenges head on. The elements will claim your life if you're not vigilant
column4: as the proliferation of elementals in these northern hills shows. We must cull the elementals one last time before we can leave this place. Are you willing to aid us while we continue to make preparations? You must kill any iceshard elementals or howling cyclones you encounter in the snowy hills surrounding the outpost.

column1: The Frozen Glade^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Nokoma Snowseer^Lurielle^The Frozen Glade^^Spirits of the Ice^Speak with Lurielle at the Frozen Glade.^For generations
column2: my people have told tales of frost nymphs cavorting in glades hidden away in the wilderness. I used to search for them as a child
column3: against the advice of my parents
column4: until I nearly froze to death. These days
column5: it isn't necessary to comb the forests for them. They've decided to reveal themselves for reasons I can only guess
column6: but I don't think the change can be ignored. Venture southeast to the Frozen Glade and seek out the nymphs
column7: but beware; you will pass the Twisted Glade on your way.

column1: Spirits of the Ice^71^All^Howling Fjord^Lurielle^Lurielle^The Enigmatic Frost Nymphs^^The Fallen Sisters
column2: Wild Vines^Lurielle at the Frozen Glade wants you to bring her 15 Icy Cores.^The ice elementals surrounding our glade were once our companions
column3: but a volatile and destructive force has swept through the land
column4: turning them against us! This is but one of the horrors my sisters and I have endured. We have revealed ourselves to you in the hope that you will help us stave off the decay that has crept into our glades and poisoned our sisters! We've been gathering the cores of the ice elementals and keeping them safe so that one day
column5: we might be able to restore them. Will you help?

column1: The Fallen Sisters^71^All^Howling Fjord^Lurielle^Lurielle^^Spirits of the Ice^^Lurielle at the Frozen Glade wants you to use her pendant on 7 Chill Nymphs.^To the southwest was a glade that used to look much like this one. Mysterious forces and alien magics are reshaping the land. The glade has thawed
column2: the sisters living there driven mad by the sudden change. We thought to reach out to them
column3: but they attacked us. I fear many may be beyond saving
column4: but I cannot give up hope. Take my pendant
column5: travel southwest to the Vibrant Glade
column6: and use it to try to free my sisters.

column1: Wild Vines^71^All^Howling Fjord^Lurielle^Lurielle^^Spirits of the Ice^^Lurielle at the Frozen Glade wants you to kill 8 Scarlet Ivy.^The sisters who lived in the Vibrant Glade
column2: to the southwest
column3: used to tend to gorgeous beds of scarlet ivy
column4: but the same force that has driven them mad has transformed their beloved ivy. The vines now grasp at the feet of the unwary
column5: or lash at any who approach the glade. Before we can reclaim the glade
column6: the vines must be tamed and uprooted. Clear as much of the ivy as you are able. It has already begun to grow out of control.

column1: Spawn of the Twisted Glade^71^All^Howling Fjord^Lurielle^Lurielle^^^Keeper Witherleaf^Lurielle at the Frozen Glade wants you to kill 10 Thornvine Creepers.^The glade to the west has been transformed into a hideous place called the Twisted Glade. Horrible beasts dwell among the trees
column2: stones
column3: and pool of the glade. I cannot guess where the creatures came from or what horrible forces animate them
column4: but they must be dealt with! I fear that if they are allowed to dominate the glade
column5: they will poison it beyond redemption. Clear the glade of these creatures who murdered our sisters.

column1: The Cleansing^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Sage Mistwalker^Sage Mistwalker^Find Sage Mistwalker^^^Sage Mistwalker at Steel Gate has advised you to cleanse yourself of Your Inner Turmoil through meditation at the Frostblade Shrine.^We braved the Rivenwood because of my troubled dreams concerning my worg life-friend
column2: Ulfang. He has called out for help
column3: and you must go to him. But
column4: you do not have the means to speak with him
column5: or walk amongst the other worgs. I know a way. First
column6: you must cleanse your inner turmoil. There is a shrine that sits at the top of Frostblade Peak
column7: northeast of Camp Winterhoof. A single path leads up to it from the western base of the mountain. Meditate there and then return to me.

column1: Seeds of the Blacksouled Keepers^71^All^Howling Fjord^Lurielle^Lurielle^^^^Lurielle at the Frozen Glade wants you to freeze 8 Spores.^The glade to the northwest
column2: now the Twisted Glade
column3: used to be home to a number of keepers of the glade. Together with the sisters
column4: they saw to the glade's upkeep. When the glade changed
column5: the sisters died
column6: but somehow the keepers managed to survive. Now
column7: they seed the land with poisonous spores that wither healthy greenery. I'll give you one of the cores from the ice elementals. Once you've destroyed a spore
column8: use the ice crystal to freeze it and keep it from regenerating.

column1: The Cleansing^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Watcher Moonleaf^Watcher Moonleaf^The Cleansing^^^Watcher Moonleaf at Steel Gate has advised you to cleanse yourself of Your Inner Turmoil through meditation at the Frostblade Shrine.^Of late I've had nightmares concerning a worg named Ulfang. He has called out for help
column2: and you must go to him. However
column3: you do not have the means to speak with him
column4: or walk amongst the other worgs. I know a way. But first
column5: you must cleanse your inner turmoil through meditation. There is a shrine that sits at the top of Frostblade Peak
column6: far to the northeast. A single path leads up to it from the western base of the mountain. Meditate there to cleanse yourself and then return to me.

column1: In Worg's Clothing^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Sage Mistwalker^Ulfang^Find Sage Mistwalker^^^Sage Mistwalker has asked you to seek out and help Ulfang in the Rivenwood.^From my dreams
column2: I know that Ulfang is in a cave on the snowy northwestern edge of the Rivenwood. He is in great danger. I have devised a magical disguise that will make you appear as a worg while you are within the Rivenwood. The disguise is weak
column3: relying upon the strange magics of that haunted wood. While it will only convince the worgs
column4: it will allow you to get close to Ulfang. Please
column5: <class>
column6: find and help him.

column1: Alpha Worg^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Ulfang^Sage Mistwalker^Find Sage Mistwalker^^^Ulfang has asked you to slay Garwal. Then
column2: return the Worg Disguise to Sage Mistwalker at Steel Gate.^When you've eaten Talonshrike's eyes
column3: you should be able see Garwal and rip out his throat! <race>-thing
column4: seek out and slay Garwal in the western Rivenwood. After you have killed him
column5: go and tell Mistwalker that I am once more the alpha worg!

column1: In Worg's Clothing^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Watcher Moonleaf^Ulfang^The Cleansing^^^Watcher Moonleaf has asked you to seek out and help Ulfang in the Rivenwood.^From my dreams
column2: I know that Ulfang is in a cave on the snowy northwestern edge of the Rivenwood. He is in great danger! I have devised a magical disguise that will make you appear as a worg while you are within the Rivenwood. The disguise is weak
column3: relying upon the strange magics of that haunted wood. While it will only convince the worgs
column4: it will allow you to get close to Ulfang. Please
column5: <class>
column6: find and help him.

column1: Alpha Worg^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Ulfang^Watcher Moonleaf^The Cleansing^^^Ulfang has asked you to slay Garwal. Then
column2: return the Worg Disguise to Watcher Moonleaf at Steel Gate.^When you've eaten Talonshrike's eyes
column3: you should be able see Garwal and rip out his throat! <race>-thing
column4: seek out and slay Garwal in the western Rivenwood. After you have killed him
column5: go and tell Moonleaf that I am once more the alpha worg!

column1: Mission: Package Retrieval^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Scout Knowles^Scout Knowles^Report to Scout Knowles^^^Scout Knowles has asked you to retrieve the Apothecary's Package from inside Halgrind. Once you have it
column2: return to the scout at the Ember Spear Tower.^Well darn
column3: we need some of that plague-stuff. I know! While you were destroying the vats
column4: I happened to spy one of the apothecaries from New Agamand being pulled into Halgrind by the vrykul down in there. Poor fella'. <name>
column5: I'd bet anything that apothecary has the goods on him. Think you could go into Halgrind and retrieve his package?

column1: Mission: Forsaken Intel^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Scout Knowles^Peppy Wrongnozzle^Report to Scout Knowles^^Absholutely... Thish Will Work!^Scout Knowles has asked you to deliver the Apothecary's Package to Peppy Wrongnozzle at Westguard Keep.^Right
column2: so I think you should get this stuff over to Peppy Wrongnozzle back at the keep. She's something of an amateur alchemist
column3: but she's the only one we've got. One thing about Peppy; she does love her drink. So
column4: you'll likely find her at the tavern 'soaking up the atmosphere'. I'm sure she'll know what to do.

column1: I'll Try Anything!^70^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Christopher Sloan^Christopher Sloan^I'll Try Anything!^All Hail the Conqueror of Skorn!^^Christopher Sloan at Fort Wildervar wants you to bring him 5 Northern Barbfish.^I never want to see another barrel of salted fish as long as I live! Filling barrels day in and day out
column2: and there are still more to be filled! I wish I hadn't used up all that bait I bought from Nat Pagle. Worked like magic
column3: it did. Now I'm lucky if I can catch a fish an hour! I hear the northern barbfish make pretty good bait
column4: but who's crazy enough to dive into a freezing cold lake and hack up the water plants in search of them? Not me... but maybe
column5: just maybe
column6: I can persuade you to...

column1: Absholutely... Thish Will Work!^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Peppy Wrongnozzle^Peppy Wrongnozzle^Absholutely... Thish Will Work!^Mission: Forsaken Intel^^Peppy Wrongnozzle at Westguard Keep has suggested that you take her Peppy's Special Mix and administer it to the Dragonflayer Vrykul Prisoner to witness its results.^Voila
column2: inshtant plague vacshine! But I sure as heck am not going to try thish on myself. And I know you don't want to be my tesht shubject! Oh
column3: I've got... I've got an idea! We've got a vrykul prishoner being held down in the cells under the keep. Why don't you take thish mix I whipped up down there
column4: and get that giant to drink it ...hic?!

column1: You Tell Him ...Hic!^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Peppy Wrongnozzle^Captain Adams^Absholutely... Thish Will Work!^^^Peppy Wrongnozzle has suckered you into giving the bad news about the Forsaken plague to Captain Adams. Visit him at Westguard Keep.^Here'sh the deal. I'm not going to the captain with thish news. I'm an amateur alchemist
column2: thish ishn't my job
column3: and I'm on break! Beshides
column4: he'sh a big grumpkin... and you know him better than I do! Sho
column5: jusht go up into the keep and tell him. I'm sure he'll be reashonable about the whole thing ...hic. <Peppy turns back to her drinking.>

column1: Mission: Plague This!^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Captain Adams^Captain Adams^Absholutely... Thish Will Work!^^^Captain Adams has ordered you to get 5 bomb hits on the Plague Tanks at New Agamand. Do not return to him at Westguard Keep until you have accomplished that.^The Royal Apothecary Society thinks they're going to perfect a new plague to melt us down where we stand?! Not on my watch! Get out to the courtyard and speak with Greer Orehammer. He's got a gryphon and some bombs ready for you. I want you to bomb the plague tanks at New Agamand to smithereens!

Into the World of Spirits^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Thoralius the Wise^Thoralius the Wise^Into the World of Spirits^Rescuing the Rescuers^^Thoralius the Wise at Valgarde wants you to find his Reagent Pouch.^While the Explorers' League may discern bits and pieces of the past through their archaeological findings and the Vice Admiral might extract some knowledge of the present through brute force
column2: the truth lies with the spirits. With the proper reagents I am able to see into the spirit world. It is there that the past
column3: present and future of Northrend resides. If you wish to learn more
column4: I will require my reagent pouch. It was lost in a ship that is now at the bottom of Daggercap Bay
column5: just east of here.

column1: The Echo of Ymiron^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Thoralius the Wise^Thoralius the Wise^Into the World of Spirits^^^Thoralius the Wise wants you to search Wyrmskull Village while you are in the spirit world and find information about the Secrets of Wyrmskull.^The spirit world has fallen under the sway of the Lich King. Fearsome creatures made of pure nightmare now stand watch over the realm of the elements. I sense that these val'kyr are guarding a terrible secret. I am too old and weak to survive another journey. You must go in my place
column2: <name>. Take this incense burner to Wyrmskull Village and use it to enter the spirit world. Find the large dwelling in the northeast! Avoid the val'kyr at all costs lest they make you a permanent fixture in their world.

column1: Anguish of Nifflevar^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Thoralius the Wise^Thoralius the Wise^Into the World of Spirits^^^Thoralius the Wise wants you to search Nifflevar while you are in the spirit world and find information about the Secrets of Nifflevar.^All that we know of the vrykul indicates that they only recently appeared in Northrend. Why
column2: then
column3: are we seeing vrykul in visions that date back 15
column4: 000 years? Surely if the vrykul had previously existed in Northrend we would have known. You must press on to Nifflevar. To get there you must go northeast
column5: through Wyrmskull Village
column6: and take the path leading up through the dam. Nifflevar is on the bluffs of the fjord. Use the incense burner once you arrive at Nifflevar and search the area for clues.

column1: The Book of Runes^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Prospector Belvar^Prospector Belvar^The Book of Runes^The Yeti Next Door^^Prospector Belvar at Fort Wildervar wants you to bring him The Book of Runes.^The vast rocky area to the southeast
column2: Giants' Run
column3: has been overrun by Iron Dwarves. Scouts have reported seeing the dwarves coaxing stone giants from the ground
column4: then carving runes on them. I can't fathom their motives
column5: but I suspect they're somehow trying to turn the giants into weapons. The iron rune stonecallers and binders carry large tomes with them
column6: which must contain the runes they're carving on the giants. Capture the pieces of this book
column7: assemble them
column8: and bring it back to me
column9: <name>.

column1: The Rune of Command^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Prospector Belvar^Prospector Belvar^The Book of Runes^^^Prospector Belvar at Fort Wildervar wants you to test the Rune of Command and defeat Binder Murdis.^Can you feel the power emanating from the runes I've carved on this tablet? They're smaller versions of the runes that the Iron Dwarves are using. We'll use it to shut down their operation. Take it to Giants' Run and use it on a stone giant that the dwarves have not altered. The giant should obey you
column2: but I've tailored the runes to restore it to its natural state after a time. The giant may prove a valuable ally in the battle against Binder Murdis
column3: the leader of the Iron Dwarf forces at Giants' Run.

column1: Mastering the Runes^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Prospector Belvar^Prospector Belvar^The Book of Runes^^^Bring a set of Iron Rune Carving Tools to Prospector Belvar at Fort Wildervar.^I've got a set of picks
column2: hammers
column3: and chisels with me
column4: but they won't work for carving these runes. The tools used by the Iron Dwarves are imbued with magic during their forging. When they're used to carve runes
column5: the symbols form much more than mere words. These runes have the power to bind
column6: compel
column7: and twist. I believe I know how it works
column8: but without a set of those tools
column9: I can't be certain. Look for kits resembling mine near the Iron Dwarf pavilions at Giants' Run and bring them to me.

column1: The Book of Runes^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Longrunner Pembe^Longrunner Pembe^The Book of Runes^Making the Horn^^Longrunner Pembe at Camp Winterhoof wants you to bring him The Book of Runes.^Chieftain Ashtotem dispatched me on a scouting mission to Giants' Run
column2: a broad
column3: rocky plateau to the southeast
column4: past the Frozen Glade. The area has been taken over by Iron Dwarves who seem to be altering the giants as they emerge from the earth. The iron rune stonecallers and binders carry large tomes with them
column5: which must contain the runes they're carving on the giants. Capture the pieces of this book
column6: assemble them
column7: and bring it back to me. It's the only way we'll understand their plans.

column1: Mastering the Runes^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Longrunner Pembe^Longrunner Pembe^The Book of Runes^^^Bring a set of Iron Rune Carving Tools to Longrunner Pembe at Camp Winterhoof.^I think I've figured out what the Iron Dwarves are doing. The tools they use are imbued with magic during their forging. When they're used to carve runes
column2: the symbols form much more than mere words. These runes have the power to bind
column3: compel
column4: and twist. If I had a set of those tools
column5: I could mimic the runes in the book. I captured one of these boxes from one of the pavilions at Giants' Run
column6: but it was empty. Look for similar boxes and recover a set of tools from them.

column1: The Rune of Command^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Longrunner Pembe^Longrunner Pembe^The Book of Runes^^^Longrunner Pembe at Camp Winterhoof wants you to test the Rune of Command and defeat Binder Murdis.^Can you feel the power emanating from the runes I've carved on this tablet? They're smaller versions of the runes that the Iron Dwarves are using. We'll use it to shut down their operation. Take it to Giants' Run and use it on a stone giant that the dwarves have not altered. The giant should obey you
column2: but I've tailored the runes to restore it to its natural state after a time. The giant may prove a valuable ally in the battle against Binder Murdis
column3: the leader of the Iron Dwarf forces at Giants' Run.

column1: Wanted: Nazan's Riding Crop^70^All^Shattrath City^Wind Trader Zhareem^Wind Trader Zhareem^^^^Wind Trader Zhareem has asked you to obtain Nazan's Riding Crop. Deliver it to him in Shattrath's Lower City to collect the reward.^Today I have a buyer who is interested in a piece that's held by the mount of Illidan's herald. I
column2: of course
column3: speak of Vazruden the Herald and his dragon mount
column4: Nazan. If you want the finder's fee that I offer in return
column5: find them flying above the Ramparts at Hellfire Citadel and return with the dragon's riding crop. My sources tell me that the item in question is personally held by the dragon. It is said that Nazan refuses to allow Vazruden to strike him with it.

column1: March of the Giants^72^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Researcher Aderan^Researcher Aderan^March of the Giants^The Yeti Next Door^^Researcher Aderan at Fort Wildervar wants you to use the Runeseeking Pick on the corpses of 4 Runed Stone Giants.^To the east
column2: at Giants' Run
column3: rune-inscribed stone giants have started to migrate north toward Frostblade Peak. What their ultimate destination is
column4: I do not know. The glowing runes inscribed in the stone flesh of the giants guide them on their journey. Use this pick to deactivate the runes on the giants' corpses and return with your findings.

column1: The Lodestone^72^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Researcher Aderan^Researcher Aderan^March of the Giants^^^Researcher Aderan at Fort Wildervar wants you to compare the Rune Sample with the Broken Tablet.^If we can locate what's luring the giants northwest
column2: we might be able to stop them before they reach their destination. Although I was able to decipher many of the runes on the samples you brought me
column3: the ones I don't know concern me the most. When I visited Giants' Run
column4: I noticed a large broken tablet jutting from the ground where the northeastern part of the area met the snow at the foot of Frostblade Peak. Take this sample
column5: compare the runes with the tablet
column6: and see what you can learn.

column1: Demolishing Megalith^72^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Researcher Aderan^Researcher Aderan^March of the Giants^^^Defeat Megalith and return to Researcher Aderan at Fort Wildervar.^Binder Murdis created Megalith to be the most powerful of the runed giants and to lead them in their mission. Defeating Megalith will leave them lost and without direction. After the expeditionary force arrives
column2: our soldiers will be able to isolate and defeat the remaining giants and oust their Iron Dwarf masters from their camps. Search the foothills of Frostblade Peak
column3: north of Giants' Run for Megalith and defeat him!

column1: Wanted: Keli'dan's Feathered Stave^70^All^Shattrath City^Wind Trader Zhareem^Wind Trader Zhareem^^^^Wind Trader Zhareem has asked you to obtain Keli'dan's Feathered Stave. Deliver it to him in Shattrath's Lower City to collect the reward.^There is no accounting for taste. Take my most recent buyer for instance. There is a blood orc within Hellfire Citadel known as Keli'dan the Breaker. He bears a most mundane stave; certainly nothing to take a second glance at. And yet
column2: this is what my customer wishes. Who am I to say no? If you desire my compensation
column3: you will find him and his stave within the Blood Furnace.

column1: Wanted: Bladefist's Seal^70^All^Shattrath City^Wind Trader Zhareem^Wind Trader Zhareem^^^^Wind Trader Zhareem has asked you to obtain Bladefist's Seal. Deliver it to him in Shattrath's Lower City to collect the reward.^Today I have a very wealthy collector in need of something very unique indeed. Warchief Kargath Bladefist carries upon his person his seal of command
column2: which he uses to sign all official documents. I want you to retrieve it for me. You will find him deep within the Shattered Halls. No doubt you will have to wade through a veritable army to get to him. I have no doubt that you will succeed.

column1: Wanted: Shattered Hand Centurions^70^All^Shattrath City^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun^^^^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun has tasked you with the deaths of 4 Shattered Hand Centurions. Return to him in Shattrath's Lower City once they all lie dead in order to collect the bounty.^Do you question your master? Neither does Mah'duun. The blood of the centurions of the Shattered Hand clan is what I seek. You will find them within the Shattered Halls of Hellfire Citadel. If you want the bounty
column2: you will not return until you have slain them all.

column1: March of the Giants^72^Horde^Howling Fjord^Sage Edan^Sage Edan^March of the Giants^Making the Horn^^Sage Edan and Camp Winterhoof wants you to use the Runeseeking Pick on the corpses of 4 Runed Stone Giants.^To the east
column2: at Giants' Run
column3: rune-inscribed stone giants have started to migrate north toward Frostblade Peak. I know nothing of their goals
column4: nor of their destination. The glowing runes inscribed in the stone flesh of the giants guide them on their journey. Fell some of these giants. Take this pick with you and use it on the corpses of the runed stone giants. It will deactivate the runes. Once you've tested enough giants
column5: return to me with your findings.

column1: The Lodestone^72^Horde^Howling Fjord^Sage Edan^Sage Edan^March of the Giants^^^Sage Edan at Camp Winterhoof wants you to compare the Rune Sample with the Broken Tablet.^We must find what's luring the giants northwest
column2: so we can stop them before they reach their destination. While the rune samples gave us some clues
column3: the unknown runes worry me. When I visited Giants' Run
column4: I noticed a large broken tablet jutting from the ground where the northeastern part of the area met the snow at the foot of Frostblade Peak. Take this sample
column5: compare the runes with the tablet
column6: and see what you can learn about the identity of this lodestone.

column1: Demolishing Megalith^72^Horde^Howling Fjord^Sage Edan^Sage Edan^March of the Giants^^^Defeat Megalith and return to Sage Edan at Camp Winterhoof.^Binder Murdis created Megalith to be a kind of keystone for the runed giants and to lead them in their mission. Defeating Megalith will leave them lost and without direction. I will ask Chieftain Ashtotem to divert some of our men as we move north and dedicate them to eliminating the last of the runed giants. Without their giants
column2: the Iron Dwarves cannot stand against us. Search the foothills of Frostblade Peak
column3: north of Giants' Run for Megalith and defeat him!

column1: Wanted: The Heart of Quagmirran^70^All^Coilfang Reservoir^Wind Trader Zhareem^Wind Trader Zhareem^^^^Wind Trader Zhareem has asked you to obtain The Heart of Quagmirran. Deliver it to him in Shattrath's Lower City to collect the reward.^I have an unusual request. A certain wealthy individual that I am in contact with off-world is interested in a macabre piece. Specifically
column2: she wants the heart of Quagmirran. I hear that the beast has three
column3: but one will suffice for our purposes. As I understand it
column4: you can find Quagmirran resting within a deep pool of water at the Slave Pens.

column1: Wanted: A Black Stalker Egg^70^All^Coilfang Reservoir^Wind Trader Zhareem^Wind Trader Zhareem^^^^Wind Trader Zhareem wants you to obtain a Black Stalker Egg. Deliver it to him in Shattrath's Lower City to collect the reward.^There is only ever one great mother of the marsh walkers in Zangarmarsh. She is always known as the Black Stalker
column2: and she hatches from one of the eggs left behind when her mother dies. I have a buyer who is interested in one of those eggs. He mentioned something about adding her as a zoo attraction. If you are interested in the reward I am offering
column3: travel to the Underbog and slay the Black Stalker for her egg.

column1: Wanted: The Warlord's Treatise^70^All^Coilfang Reservoir^Wind Trader Zhareem^Wind Trader Zhareem^^^^Wind Trader Zhareem has asked you to acquire The Warlord's Treatise. Deliver it to him in Shattrath's Lower City to collect the reward.^While it is known that Warlord Kalithresh of the naga is a great warrior in his own right
column2: there are fewer who know that he has codified all of his knowledge. One of my customers is aware of it though
column3: and is keenly interested in obtaining his treatise. I ask that you travel to the Steamvault in Coilfang Reservoir and obtain this book for me.

column1: Wanted: Coilfang Myrmidons^70^All^Coilfang Reservoir^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun^^^^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun has asked you to slay 14 Coilfang Myrmidons. Return to him in Shattrath's Lower City once they all lie dead in order to collect the bounty.^Mah'duun hears and obeys
column2: and I now ask you to be my instrument. It has been related to me that the myrmidons of the coilfang tribe must be destroyed. Seek them out within the humid confines of the Steamvault underneath Coilfang Reservoir. I will accept nothing less than their utter annihilation.

column1: Wanted: The Headfeathers of Ikiss^70^All^Shattrath City^Wind Trader Zhareem^Wind Trader Zhareem^^^^Wind Trader Zhareem has asked you to acquire The Headfeathers of Ikiss. Deliver them to him in Shattrath's Lower City to collect the reward.^I've recently been approached by a tauren whose husband is about to be elevated to chieftain. She wishes to make a special addition to his headdress. Specifically
column2: she wants to obtain the headfeathers from the dastardly Talon King Ikiss. If you are interested in collecting my reward
column3: travel to Auchindoun's Sethekk Halls and find him.

column1: Wanted: Shaffar's Wondrous Pendant^70^All^Shattrath City^Wind Trader Zhareem^Wind Trader Zhareem^^^^Wind Trader Zhareem wants you to obtain Shaffar's Wondrous Amulet. Deliver it to him in Shattrath's Lower City to collect the reward.^Today I have a personal request of you
column2: yet the reward will certainly match the danger. My family has a 'history'
column3: shall we say
column4: with Nexus-Prince Shaffar and his followers. If the amulet he wears were to fall into my hands then surely that would mean that he had been dealt with. If the bounty I am offering is of interest to you then journey to his lair within Auchindoun's Mana-Tombs.

column1: Wanted: The Exarch's Soul Gem^70^All^Shattrath City^Wind Trader Zhareem^Wind Trader Zhareem^^^^Wind Trader Zhareem has asked you to recover The Exarch's Soul Gem. Deliver it to him in Shattrath's Lower City to collect the reward.^Within Auchindoun's Auchenai Crypts many unsavory experiments are undertaken in the pursuit of a greater understanding of the necromantic arts. Many are the spirits that are tortured or destroyed therein. I have a customer who is interested in the liberation of one of those spirits. I have been informed that this spirit is contained within a soul gem held by none other than Exarch Maladaar himself. Seek him out within the crypts with all due haste and return to me with the gem.

Wanted: Murmur's Whisper^70^All^Shattrath City^Wind Trader Zhareem^Wind Trader Zhareem^^^^Wind Trader Zhareem has asked you to obtain Murmur's Whisper. Deliver it to him in Shattrath's Lower City to collect the reward.^When I'm done speaking
column2: you may not want to take this commission. I have an eccentric client who specializes in the study of dead realities. It is rumored that the being known as Murmur destroyed the last world from which he was summoned. The professor is interested in examining his 'whisper' as he called it to understand how it is that Murmur accomplished such a feat. Will you journey to the Shadow Labyrinth within Auchindoun and retrieve it for me?

column1: Wanted: Malicious Instructors^70^All^Shattrath City^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun^^^^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun wants you to kill 3 Malicious Instructors. Return to him in Shattrath's Lower City once they all lie dead in order to collect the bounty.^Mah'duun has heard it said that none are as cruel as the six-armed demonesses inside the Shadow Labyrinth. Go to Auchindoun
column2: seek them out
column3: kill them all. If you cannot accomplish so simple a task
column4: we do not have anything further to say to one another.

column1: Revenge is Tasty^70^All^Cooking^The Rokk^The Rokk^^^^The Rokk in Lower City has asked you to cook up some Kaliri Stew using his cooking pot. Return to him when it's done.^I'm providing the catering for some unusual party guests tonight. One of these fellows was flying around in Skettis and got knocked to the ground by a monstrous kaliri--his leg was broken badly. They've requested something special for his get well party: Kaliri Stew. I can loan you my cooking pot so you can whip up a batch of stew for me. The recipe itself is simple
column2: but you'll need to get a giant kaliri wing and some cooked warp burgers.

column1: Wanted: The Epoch Hunter's Head^70^All^Caverns of Time^Wind Trader Zhareem^Wind Trader Zhareem^^^^Wind Trader Zhareem has asked you to obtain the Epoch Hunter's Head. Deliver it to him in Shattrath's Lower City to collect the reward.^The tastes of my customers range from the mundane to the exotic. And sometimes they want to do very mundane things with the exotic objects they seek. Such is the case with my latest request. My client
column2: who shall remain nameless
column3: wishes to obtain the head of the Epoch Hunter to mount on his wall. <class>
column4: will you find a way to travel back in time to Old Hillsbrad and procure said head for my trophy-hunting patron?

column1: Super Hot Stew^70^All^Cooking^The Rokk^The Rokk^^^^The Rokk in Lower City has asked you to cook up some Demon Broiled Surprise using his cooking pot
column2: two Mok'Nathal Shortribs and a Crunchy Serpent. Return to him when it's done.^I'm trying to invent something with some real zing. But to be honest
column3: I'm more of an idea goblin these days. I've lost my sense of adventure. But you... remind me of my younger days; ready to take on the world with a sword in one hand and a skillet in the other. I want you to take my beloved cooking pot and head out to Blade's Edge. Throw in some shortribs and crunchy serpent--already cooked for extra flavor--and broil it over an abyssal's corpse
column4: the only thing hot enough to do the trick.

column1: Manalicious^70^All^Cooking^The Rokk^The Rokk^^^^The Rokk in Lower City has asked you collect 15 Mana Berries from the Eco-Domes in Netherstorm.^Wouldn't you know it
column2: I think my foodstuffs are up to date and someone comes along and requests the unusual: Mana Berry Delight. Unfortunately
column3: mana berries are only found in the eco-domes of Netherstorm. Just don't bother looking around Stormspire--it's picked clean. I could only trust someone trained in the culinary arts to pick the best berries
column4: so don't let me down!

column1: Soup for the Soul^70^All^Cooking^The Rokk^The Rokk^^^^The Rokk in Lower City has asked you to cook up some Spiritual Soup using his cooking pot. Return to him when it's done.^Death is in the air. I've never had so many orders for my famous soup--it lifts your spirits and soothes the soul. And I know a fellow cook when I see one! Would you like to help me out and get a cut of the profits? Here
column2: take my cooking pot
column3: gather some clefthoof meat and I'll let you in on a little secret. What makes my soup so good for the soul? It's not chicken--I cook it at the Ancestral Grounds in Nagrand to soak up all that spiritual stuff there.

column1: Wanted: Aeonus's Hourglass^70^All^Caverns of Time^Wind Trader Zhareem^Wind Trader Zhareem^^^^Wind Trader Zhareem has asked you to acquire Aeonus's Hourglass. Deliver it to him in Shattrath's Lower City to collect the reward.^I swear that some of my customers are crazy. There are possessions that you go after
column2: and there are ones that you dare not even think of! My current client is clearly over-the-top insane. He covets the hourglass that Aeonus holds. Yes
column3: you heard right
column4: Aeonus of the Infinite Dragonflight! Who am I to argue since he's paying a king's ransom? So
column5: ready to go to the Caverns of Time and travel to the Black Morass to retrieve it for me?

column1: Wanted: Rift Lords^70^All^Caverns of Time^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun^^^^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun wants you to kill 4 Rift Lords. Return to him in Shattrath's Lower City once they all lie dead in order to collect the bounty.^Mah'duun knows where you must go. Mah'duun knows that you must kill rift lords. But
column2: Mah'duun does not know exactly when. I know that does not make sense
column3: but the voice on the winds was not more specific. Travel to the Black Morass through the Caverns of Time and the way shall be made clear.

column1: Wanted: A Warp Splinter Clipping^70^All^Tempest Keep^Wind Trader Zhareem^Wind Trader Zhareem^^^^Wind Trader Zhareem has asked you to obtain a Warp Splinter Clipping. Deliver it to him in Shattrath's Lower City to collect the reward.^Not long ago
column2: I was approached by a kaldorei druidess with a touching request. And plenty of gold
column3: of course! It would appear that the forces of Darnassus wish to restore an ancient of the arcane known as Warp Splinter. The giant tree has been confused or corrupted
column4: I'm not certain
column5: but you'll find it inside of the Botanica at Tempest Keep. She said that all they would need to regrow him was a small clipping.

column1: Wanted: Sunseeker Channelers^70^All^Tempest Keep^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun^^^^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun wants you to kill 6 Sunseeker Channelers. Return to him in Shattrath's Lower City once they all lie dead in order to collect the bounty.^It has been whispered to Mah'duun that the channelers of the military unit known as the Sunseekers must be killed today. They are to be found within the Botanica at Tempest Keep. You want the bounty
column2: you kill the channelers.

column1: Wanted: Pathaleon's Projector^70^All^Tempest Keep^Wind Trader Zhareem^Wind Trader Zhareem^^^^Wind Trader Zhareem has asked you to acquire Pathaleon's Projector. Deliver it to him in Shattrath's Lower City to collect the reward.^I always assumed that Pathaleon the Calculator used magic to project his image across Outland. Apparently I was wrong. My latest customer tells me that the blood elf uses a mechanical device for his communication with the leaders of Prince Kael'thas's special projects. As I understand it
column2: he acquired it from the Zaxxis rebels in the Netherstorm. My client wishes to obtain the projector. Why don't you pay Pathaleon a visit? He can be found within the Mechanar at Tempest Keep.

column1: Wanted: Tempest-Forge Destroyers^70^All^Tempest Keep^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun^^^^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun wants you to destroy 5 Tempest-Forge Destroyers. Return to him in Shattrath's Lower City once they all lie dead in order to collect the bounty.^There are mechanical constructs within the Mechanar which Mah'duun has been told must be dismantled. Go to Tempest Keep
column2: find the tempest-forge destroyers and destroy them. Then you may return to collect the bounty.

column1: Wanted: The Scroll of Skyriss^70^All^Tempest Keep^Wind Trader Zhareem^Wind Trader Zhareem^^^^Wind Trader Zhareem has asked you to obtain The Scroll of Skyriss. Deliver it to him in Shattrath's Lower City to collect the reward.^Today's client seeks something truly unique. It is said that Harbinger Skyriss is a servant of the Old Gods. It is also said that he carries a large scroll that contains their instructions for his domination of life in the universe on their behalf. My current buyer wishes to get <his /her> hands on that scroll
column2: nevermind that <he /she> won't be able to read the language upon it. Travel to Tempest Keep's Arcatraz and get it for me
column3: will you
column4: <class>?

column1: Wanted: Arcatraz Sentinels^70^All^Tempest Keep^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun^^^^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun wants you to dismantle 5 Arcatraz Sentinels. Return to him in Shattrath's Lower City once that has been accomplished in order to collect the bounty.^The sentinels within the Arcatraz have gone haywire. The prisoners run rampant and the guards attack those that would help. Mah'duun hears the speaker on the nether winds. The speaker says to destroy the sentinels. Accomplish this and today's bounty is yours.

I've Got a Flying Machine!^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Steel Gate Chief Archaeologist^Steel Gate Chief Archaeologist^See to the Operations^^^The Steel Gate Chief Archaeologist wants you to transport 3 Sacks of Relics from the bottom of the site and take them to the platform on the north or south side of Steel Gate.^Well
column2: what are you waiting for
column3: there's work to be done! Here's the keys to our flying machine. Grab three sacks of relics and haul them up to the crane platforms on the north and south sides of Steel Gate. I'll mark them for you. Hurry up! We haven't got all day!

column1: Steel Gate Patrol^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Steel Gate Chief Archaeologist^Steel Gate Chief Archaeologist^See to the Operations^^^You're Steel Gate's ace pilot now
column2: so the Steel Gate Chief Archaeologist wants you to keep patrol around the dig site and fight off anything that attacks.^Eh? Yer back for another day's work? Well
column3: alright
column4: here's the keys. We don't need any haulin' today
column5: so just keep an eye out for anything suspicious
column6: okay? I've hooked her up with some rockets and a machine gun - just in case.

column1: Where is Explorer Jaren?^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Overseer Irena Stonemantle^Explorer Jaren^^^^Overseer Irena Stonemantle has asked you to locate her fiance
column2: Explorer Jaren.^<name>
column3: my betrothed
column4: Jaren
column5: went west with a small group of explorers to check into rumors of artifacts on the Chillmere Coast. But there are murloc down there
column6: and I fear the worst has befallen them. Surely you have time to see if they're alright? There's a way down to the beach just to the southwest
column7: though watch out for the worgs and other things lurking in the woods.

column1: And You Thought Murlocs Smelled Bad!^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Explorer Jaren^Explorer Jaren^^^^Explorer Jaren has asked you to kill 15 Scourge of any type along the Chillmere Coast. Return to him once you have done so.^Originally I came down here to investigate some rumors about artifacts to be dug up. I knew that there were murlocs along the coast here
column2: but I never in a million years thought I'd see this. <The explorer pokes his head out to look around the tree.> The Scourge are out there
column3: and they're changing murlocs
column4: and anything else they can get their hands on
column5: into the walking dead! <class>
column6: I think it's our duty to do something about this. Think you could take out a good chunk of those Scourge?

column1: It's a Scourge Device^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Scourge Device^Explorer Jaren^It's a Scourge Device^^^Deliver the Scourge Device to Explorer Jaren on the Chillmere Coast.^The Scourge creature you just destroyed had this device held in its clutches. It has a jewel set into it which looks similar to the one that tops the scourging crystals. Surely
column2: Explorer Jaren would like to have a look at this.

column1: Bring Down Those Shields^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Explorer Jaren^Explorer Jaren^It's a Scourge Device^^^Explorer Jaren on the Chillmere Coast has asked you to destroy 3 Scourging Crystals.^Look at the button on the side of the controller here. I bet if you got close enough to one of those scourging crystals
column2: you could use the controller to bring its shield down. Then it would simply be a matter of destroying the thing before its shield goes back up. What do you say
column3: <name>? You up for it? I can guarantee a nice reward for you if you can bring down those shields and destroy the crystals. It's the least we can do to keep the Scourge from making more of their own kind.

column1: And You Thought Murlocs Smelled Bad!^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Apothecary Anastasia^Apothecary Anastasia^^^^Apothecary Anastasia has asked you to destroy 15 Scourge of any type along the Chillmere Coast. Return to her at the Apothecary Camp once you have done so.^I came here to investigate a rumor about a Scourge presence nearby. I expected murlocs along the coast down below
column2: but I never thought I'd see this! The Scourge are down there
column3: and they're changing murlocs
column4: and anything else they can get their hands on
column5: into the walking dead! <class>
column6: we will not suffer them to create more of their kind
column7: especially not from murlocs! There is a ramp down to the beach just northwest of the camp. See to it that you deal with the Scourge in a timely fashion!

column1: It's a Scourge Device^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Scourge Device^Apothecary Anastasia^It's a Scourge Device^^^Deliver the Scourge Device to Apothecary Anastasia at the Apothecary Camp.^The Scourge creature you just destroyed had this device held in its clutches. It has a jewel set into it which looks similar to the one that tops the scourging crystals. Surely
column2: Apothecary Anastasia would like to have a look at this.

column1: Bring Down Those Shields^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Apothecary Anastasia^Apothecary Anastasia^It's a Scourge Device^^^Apothecary Anastasia at the Apothecary Camp has asked you to destroy 3 Scourging Crystals.^Look at the button on the side of the controller here. I bet if you got close enough to one of those scourging crystals
column2: you could use the controller to bring its shield down. Then it would simply be a matter of destroying the thing before its shield goes back up. Brave enough to hazard another trip down there
column3: <name>? I can guarantee a nice reward for you if you can bring down those shields and destroy the crystals. How can you refuse if it means less Scourge
column4: especially ones made from murlocs?

column1: Everything Must Be Ready^70^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Quartermaster Brevin^Gil Grisert^^All Hail the Conqueror of Skorn!^Preying Upon the Weak^Speak with Gil Grisert at Fort Wildervar.^When the expeditionary force moves north
column2: Captain Adams expects everything to be ready at Fort Wildervar. The scouts and craftsmen there have been tasked with preparing the gear and rations for our men for the climb into the hills. The captain's famous for his temper
column3: so I want to send someone ahead to check on the preparations. Fort Wildervar is far to the northeast
column4: beyond Skorn
column5: up in the snow-covered areas near the border with Grizzly Hills. Find Gil Grisert there and make sure he is prepared.

column1: The One That Got Away^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Christopher Sloan^Christopher Sloan^I'll Try Anything!^^^Christopher Sloan at Fort Wildervar wants you to defeat Frostfin.^The barbfish you brought should work well as bait for most fish
column2: but I fear it'll attract a monster! When I first arrived
column3: I put some of Nat Pagle's favorite bait on my hook and cast it into the water. A huge monster latched on
column4: with giant teeth and icicles hanging from its fins! Would've pulled me into those icy waters if I hadn't cut the line! I can't use the new bait until ol' Frostfin's been dealt with. Use this bait near the sunken boat in the middle of the lake. He won't be able to resist!

column1: Camp Winterhoof^70^Horde^Howling Fjord^Cormath the Courier^Chieftain Ashtotem^^^^Speak to Chieftain Ashtotem at Camp Winterhoof.^In my travels as a courier
column2: I've seen a number of strange denizens of the Howling Fjord
column3: but one group stands out. From a distance
column4: they look like tauren
column5: but upon closer inspection
column6: they're quite different -- sturdier and shaggier. I found one of their settlements far to the north
column7: beyond Halgrind
column8: Skorn
column9: and the northern forests. Camp Winterhoof
column10: it's called
column11: and it sits in the foothills of Gjalerhorn near the border with Grizzly Hills. Make contact with them
column12: and see if they might be of use to us.

column1: Brother Betrayers^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Ulfang^Ulfang^The Cleansing^^^Ulfang has asked you to kill the traitorous worgs
column2: Bjomolf and Varg. Return to him in disguise in the Rivenwood after you have done so.^Watcher Moonleaf is from my dreams! If you are her friend
column3: you are mine. I was alpha male until the last full moon. Then the strange white worg
column4: Garwal
column5: came from the north
column6: and with the help of my once-brothers
column7: he quickly became alpha worg. There is something unnatural about him. To help
column8: you must first kill those who betrayed me. Bjomolf hunts to the northwest of a place called Steel Gate. And look for Varg to the southeast
column9: near the West Spear Tower. They will not be fooled by your form.

column1: Brother Betrayers^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Ulfang^Ulfang^Find Sage Mistwalker^^^Ulfang has asked you to kill the traitorous worgs
column2: Bjomolf and Varg. Return to him in disguise in the Rivenwood after you have done so.^Mistwalker is from my dreams! If you are his friend
column3: you are mine. I was alpha male until the last full moon. Then the strange white worg
column4: Garwal
column5: came from the north
column6: and with the help of my once-brothers
column7: he quickly became alpha. There is something unnatural about him. To help
column8: you must first kill those who betrayed me. Bjomolf hunts to the northwest of a place the two-legs call Steel Gate. And look for Varg to the southeast
column9: near the West Spear Tower. They will not be fooled by your form.

column1: Eyes of the Eagle^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Ulfang^Ulfang^The Cleansing^^^Ulfang has asked you to collect the Eyes of the Eagle. Return to him in disguise in the Rivenwood after you have done so.^Garwal hides himself behind an unnatural magic. None can see him unless he wants you to. There may be one chance we can take
column2: though. My enemy
column3: the great eagle
column4: Talonshrike
column5: is said to have eyes that can see anything. If you were to take her eyes
column6: then you would surely be able to see Garwal. Talonshrike keeps her nest at the base of a waterfall just to the southwest of the vrykul place called Skorn. If you touch the eggs in her nest
column7: she will come down from the sky to kill you. Get her eyes.

column1: Eyes of the Eagle^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Ulfang^Ulfang^Find Sage Mistwalker^^^Ulfang has asked you to collect the Eyes of the Eagle. Return to him in disguise in the Rivenwood after you have done so.^Garwal hides himself behind an unnatural magic. None can see him unless he wants you to. There may be one chance we can take
column2: though. My enemy
column3: the great eagle
column4: Talonshrike
column5: is said to have eyes that can see anything. If you were to take her eyes
column6: then you would surely be able to see Garwal. Talonshrike keeps her nest at the base of a waterfall just to the southwest of the vrykul place called Skorn. If you touch the eggs in her nest
column7: she will come down from the sky to kill you. Get her eyes.

column1: We Call Him Steelfeather^70^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Gil Grisert^Gil Grisert^Down to the Wire^^^Locate Steelfeather circling Fort Wildervar and use the Feathered Charm to discover his secret. Report your findings to Gil Grisert.^We see one brave hippogryph circling over the fort
column2: then swooping down and taking prey. Jethan over there has taken a couple of shots at the creature
column3: but his arrows bounced right off! We've taken to calling this remarkable creature Steelfeather
column4: but we can't see why he prefers the area around Fort Wildervar. Most hippogryphs are wary of people. Researcher Aderan has helped us fashion a charm from one of the creature's feathers. He claims it will allow the user to see through Steelfeather's eyes.

column1: The Path to Payback^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Guard Captain Zorek^Guard Captain Zorek^The Path to Payback^Rescuing the Rescuers^^Guard Captain Zorek at Valgarde in Howling Fjord wants you to recover the Harpoon Operation Manual.^Two weeks ago our chief engineer got his hands on a vrykul harpoon gun - the same type of gun that the vrykul use to take down our ships. By studying that gun he managed to put together a comprehensive operation manual. Unfortunately he was abducted and taken north of here to Wyrmskull Village. We eventually did find him
column2: but near death and without the manual. His dying words indicated that the manual was lost in the Utgarde Catacombs
column3: located at the northwest end of Wyrmskull. Get me that manual!

column1: It Goes to 11...^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Lieutenant Icehammer^Lieutenant Icehammer^The Path to Payback^^^Lieutenant Icehammer in the Howling Fjord wants you to destroy the Dragonflayer Longhouse
column2: Dragonflayer Dockhouse
column3: Dragonflayer Storage Facility and 8 Dragonflayer Defenders.^We must strike while the vrykul forces are in disarray! Take the harpoon control mechanism to Nifflevar and locate the northernmost harpoon building on the bluff side of the village. Once there
column4: commandeer one of the vrykul harpoon guns that are stationed on the building's deck. Use the harpoon gun to rain hell upon Wyrmskull Village! Destroy the longhouse
column5: dockhouse
column6: storage facility and any defenders that the vrykul may send at you! Do this and Daggercap Bay will become a much safer port!

column1: Trident of the Son^71^All^Howling Fjord^Old Icefin^Old Icefin^^^^Old Icefin wants you to obtain Rotgill's Trident. Return it to him on the small island on the Chillmere Coast.^<From the scratches he makes in the rock
column2: you see several symbols: a trident
column3: a mur'ghoul
column4: the sun
column5: a wrecked ship
column6: and a rough stick-figure of yourself.> <Puzzling out what the murloc is conveying takes a while. Obviously he wants you to get a trident from the Chillmere Coast
column7: but the image of the sun is puzzling. That is until you realize he means his son.> <His son was changed into a mur'ghoul! He wants you to find him to the south near the wrecked ship and return with his trident.>

column1: The Enemy's Legacy^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Scribe Seguine^Scribe Seguine^^^^Go into Nifflevar
column2: north of Ghostblade Post and look for the Saga of the Winter Curse
column3: the Saga of the Val'kyr and the Saga of the Twins.^As our armies march through Northrend
column4: our enemies will not suffer mere defeat. Their houses will burn
column5: their corpses will be devoured by our plagues
column6: all trace of their existence will be lost. This worries me as a seeker of knowledge. The eastern town of Nifflevar will soon be razed by our forces in Vengeance Landing. The vrykul bard
column7: Helgus
column8: lived there and wrote three sagas: the Saga of the Twins
column9: the Saga of the Winter Curse and the Saga of the Val'kyr. Obtain them before Nifflevar is destroyed.

column1: Shield Hill^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^"Hacksaw" Jenny^"Hacksaw" Jenny^^^^"Hacksaw" Jenny wants you to bring her 5 Ancient Vrykul Bones from the reanimated Vrykul in Shield Hill
column2: south of New Agamand.^My work should be extremely easy in a time of war. There ought to be usable body parts everywhere. It's not that simple
column3: though. With these eggheads making all sorts of killer plagues and sending them to enemy towns
column4: most of the material gets contaminated. There is a place
column5: though
column6: where usable samples exist. Shield Hill
column7: south of here
column8: is an ancient vrykul burial ground where the dead walk but are not afflicted with any plague - ours or the Lich King's. Get me some bones
column9: I'll pay ya well.

column1: Locating the Mechanism^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Guard Captain Zorek^Guard Captain Zorek^The Path to Payback^^^Guard Captain Zorek at Valgarde in Howling Fjord wants you to bring him a Harpoon Control Mechanism.^Don't worry
column2: <name>; this is all going to lead to something big! HUGE! You're just going to have to trust me for now and do as I ask of you. We need to get the mechanism mentioned in the manual for the next step of the plan. I have a strong suspicion that you'll find one on one of those vrykul that operate the harpoon guns in Wyrmskull Village. You'll find them on the east side of the village
column3: on the docks by the longhouses.

column1: Meet Lieutenant Icehammer...^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Guard Captain Zorek^Lieutenant Icehammer^The Path to Payback^^^Guard Captain Zorek wants you to take the Harpoon Control Mechanism to Lieutenant Icehammer stationed outside of Nifflevar.^Do you see those vrykul buildings on the bluffs to the northeast? The vrykul call that place Nifflevar. It's where most of their harpoon attacks on our frigates originate. Well guess what? The time for payback has come
column2: <name>. I need you to take this harpoon control mechanism and meet up with Lieutenant Icehammer
column3: who is hiding out in a vrykul building northwest of Nifflevar. When you're ready I'll place you on the back of one of our gryphons and zip you right to him!

column1: Keeper Witherleaf^71^All^Howling Fjord^Lurielle^Lurielle^^Spawn of the Twisted Glade^^Lurielle at the Frozen Glade wants you to kill Keeper Witherleaf.^You have been a great friend and ally to us
column2: <name>. There is one more thing I must ask of you. You have seen the corruption of the Twisted Glade and the beasts that dwell there. The blacksouled keepers will continue raising these abominations from the waters and soil of our glade unless we act against them. The most powerful of the blacksouled keepers is known as Keeper Witherleaf. Slay him
column3: <name>
column4: and open the way for the redemption of the glade as you once redeemed my sisters.

column1: Drop It then Rock It!^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Lieutenant Icehammer^Lieutenant Icehammer^The Path to Payback^^^Lieutenant Icehammer in the Howling Fjord wants you to place the Alliance Banner in Baleheim and then defend the banner against attackers.^I'm not about to put the fate of this mission into the hands of some untested scrub. Now
column2: if you want to prove to me that you've got what it takes to carry out this mission
column3: you'll need to do what I tell you. Take this battle standard and head over to Baleheim
column4: directly north of here. Once you're at Baleheim
column5: find the center of town and drop our flag. Fight off any vrykul dirt bags that attempt to take down our beloved flag and return to me once you've established Alliance dominance!

column1: Harpoon Master Yavus^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Lieutenant Icehammer^Lieutenant Icehammer^The Path to Payback^^^Lieutenant Icehammer in the Howling Fjord wants you to slay Harpoon Master Yavus at Nifflevar.^That was a fairly strong showing at Baleheim
column2: <name>. Before you go off patting yourself on the back there's work to be done at Nifflevar. We've located the vrykul responsible for the majority of the harpoon attacks on our frigates - goes by the name of Yavus. You'll find him in the main harpoon structure on the bluffs of Nifflevar
column3: southeast of here. Track him down and execute him for crimes against the Alliance! Do me proud
column4: <name>!

column1: Sleeping Giants^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Mage-Lieutenant Malister^Mage-Lieutenant Malister^^In Service to the Light^^Mage-Lieutenant Malister has tasked you with slaying 5 Dormant Vrykul. Return to him at Westguard Keep when you have done so.^I've overheard what you've had to say with Father Levariol. Allow me to suggest that he's not having you go far enough. You must also deal with the vrykul that lie dormant in the Waking Halls beneath Gjalerbron! I have no doubt that the rituals involved with awakening them are the key to their downfall. Most likely the necrolords have some device that you can use to bring the vrykul out of their dormant state prematurely. Surely such a disruption will prove fatal to the vrykul.

Sleeping Giants^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Ahota Whitefrost^Ahota Whitefrost^^Of Keys and Cages^^Ahota Whitefrost has tasked you with slaying 5 Dormant Vrykul. Return to him at Camp Winterhoof when you have done so.^I've overheard what you've had to say with Greatmother Ankha. With all due respect
column2: she's not having you go far enough. You must also deal with the vrykul that lie dormant in the Waking Halls beneath Gjalerbron! I have no doubt that the rituals involved with awakening them are the key to their downfall. Most likely the necrolords have some device that you can use to bring the vrykul out of their dormant state prematurely. Surely such a disruption will prove fatal to the vrykul.

column1: Forgotten Treasure^71^All^Howling Fjord^Handsome Terry^Handsome Terry^Pirates of the North Seas^Street "Cred"^Gambling Debt^Handsome Terry at Scalawag Point wants you to bring him 1 Amani Vase and 1 Eagle Figurine from the shipwreck to the south.^I've made my fortune by specializing in treasure that regular pirates don't appreciate: art
column2: antiquities
column3: collector's pieces. Black Conrad's fleet sank south of here years ago. All the gold and jewelry was picked clean by divers
column4: but two ancient relics remain there. One is a museum-quality Amani vase
column5: the other is an eagle figurine. Go and retrieve them for me and I'll vouch for you with the other pirates. I'll even throw in something to make your underwater adventure a bit more manageable.

column1: Let's Go Surfing Now^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Lieutenant Icehammer^Guard Captain Zorek^The Path to Payback^^^Use the large Vrykul Harpoon Gun in Nifflevar to launch yourself into Valgarde. Report your victory over the Vrykul to Guard Captain Zorek.^Navigating the steep bluffs of Howling Fjord can be nerve-racking! I've come up with a solution to ease that burden by utilizing vrykul technology and dwarven ingenuity. With just a few adjustments and some fine tuning I've created Icehammer's harpoon controller! Of course it hasn't been tested
column2: but that's what you're here for! Take the controller to the big gun in Nifflevar and use it to launch yourself into Valgarde. Report your victory to Zorek. Oh yea
column3: you can keep the controller.

column1: Daggercap Divin'^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Harold Lagras^Harold Lagras^^^^Harold Lagras at the bottom of Daggercap Bay wants you to recover 10 Valgarde Supply Crates.^Hey... Uh... What's up? What are you doing down here? Me? Oh... Well
column2: you see... I'm... Um... I'm trying to clean this place up! Orders from Keller himself! He says to me
column3: "Harry
column4: I want you to put on a divin' bell and search the shipwrecks of Daggercap for OUR stuff..." Say
column5: maybe you could lend me a hand while you're down here. Throughout the bay here are all kinds of goodies
column6: err
column7: I mean supplies. Go out and bring me back whatever you find. Use this diving helm so you don't run out of air and die.

column1: The Explorers' League Outpost^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Beltrand McSorf^Stanwad^The Human League^^^Deliver McSorf's Bundle to Stanwad at the Explorers' League Outpost in Howling Fjord.^It's all a bunch of cryptic nonsense! Even with this cipher I can't make heads or tails of these tablets. Admittedly
column2: cryptography is not my strong point. You'll need to take the cipher and tablets to our cryptographer
column3: Stanwad. Unfortunately
column4: I haven't heard from Stanwad in two weeks. He took a team of twenty scientists to the dig sites on the southeastern bluffs of the fjord and hasn't been heard from since. The best I can do is have McGoyver over there give you a lift with his flying machine.

column1: Alicia's Poem^70^All^Shattrath City^Alicia^Caylee Dak^^^^You have been asked to deliver Alicia's Poem to Caylee Dak in Shattrath City in Outland.^Hi
column2: I wrote a poem for my friend Caylee. She likes to hang out with the Aldor in Shattrath City. You know
column3: in Outland? Could you take my poem to her? My mommy says I'm too young to go to Shattrath City!

column1: The Slumbering King^72^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Mezhen's Writings^Captain Adams^^Dealing With Gjalerbron^^Defeat Queen Angerboda and stop the ritual to awaken King Ymiron. Should you manage to do so
column2: return to Westguard Keep and report your success to Captain Adams.^A sheaf of parchment drops from the still hand of the overlord. Upon it you can discern the outline of the rituals that are taking place in the catacombs below. However
column3: it appears that the queen of the vrykul
column4: Angerboda
column5: is having difficulty awakening King Ymiron. The ritual is taking place within the large chamber
column6: known as the Winter's Terrace
column7: on the north end of Gjalerbron. If you hurry
column8: you may be able to stop her before it is too late.

column1: The Slumbering King^72^Horde^Howling Fjord^Mezhen's Writings^Chieftain Ashtotem^^Dealing With Gjalerbron^^Defeat Queen Angerboda and stop the ritual to awaken King Ymiron. Should you manage to do so
column2: return to Camp Winterhoof and report your success to Chieftain Ashtotem.^A sheaf of parchment drops from the still hand of the overlord. Upon it you can discern the outline of the rituals that are taking place in the catacombs below. However
column3: it appears that the queen of the vrykul
column4: Angerboda
column5: is having difficulty awakening King Ymiron. The ritual is taking place within the large chamber
column6: known as the Winter's Terrace
column7: on the north end of Gjalerbron. If you hurry
column8: you may be able to stop her before it is too late.

column1: The Fragrance of Money^71^All^Howling Fjord^Handsome Terry^Handsome Terry^Pirates of the North Seas^^^Handsome Terry at Scalawag Point in Howling Fjord wants you to obtain 4 Bear Musk from the Rabid Brown Bears in the surrounding area.^Us pirates are known for many things
column2: but hygiene isn't one of them. Most pirate ships be carrying five or six times as many rats as people. It's no wonder all the bears on this island caught the rabies soon after we moved in. Long story short
column3: the boss wants 'em all dead. It just so happens I know a recipe for a bear musk fragrance popular among Stormwind nobles. We kill the bears and sell the musk. I see a fine business opportunity for us here. What say ye?

column1: Feeding the Survivors^71^All^Howling Fjord^Elder Atuik^Elder Atuik^^^Arming Kamagua^Elder Atuik at Kamagua in Howling Fjord wants you to obtain 6 pieces of Island Shoveltusk Meat from Island Shoveltusk in the Isle of Spears.^We tuskarr rely mostly on our fish catch for sustenance. In times of great need
column2: however
column3: we will on occasion hunt land animals. The nearby village of Iskaal was recently attacked by pirates and the survivors just keep pouring in. Our catch has been modest this week
column4: but there are many shoveltusk on the island and their meat is plentiful. Aid my people by hunting these great beasts and obtaining their meat.

column1: Arming Kamagua^71^All^Howling Fjord^Elder Atuik^Elder Atuik^Arming Kamagua^Feeding the Survivors^^Elder Atuik wants you to obain 3 Chimaera Horns.^Issliruk
column2: the spirit of war
column3: is depicted as a silver eagle by my people. Our stories tell of how Issliruk fought against a hundred worgs to save his young. It is time for us
column4: too
column5: to fight against our foes to save our brethren. We will need to craft new weapons. The horns of the frostwing chimaera that make their home in the snowy parts of the island are sharp and are easily crafted into spear tips. Bring me the best of these horns that you can find.

column1: Avenge Iskaal^71^All^Howling Fjord^Elder Atuik^Elder Atuik^Arming Kamagua^^Travel to Moa'ki Harbor^Elder Atuik wants you to go to Iskaal and slay 8 Northsea Slavers. Use the Horn of Kamagua should you need assistance.^The totem of Issliruk is ready
column2: <name>
column3: and for that I thank you. We must cast our peaceful ways for the time being and strike at those who've attacked our land and our kin. The pirate slavers that raided Iskaal have lost their minds and slaughtered all their captives. Go to Iskaal
column4: to the east of here and do what must must be done. Take this horn and call on my brethren should you need assistance.

column1: Zeh'gehn Sez^71^All^Howling Fjord^Zeh'gehn^Handsome Terry^Pirates of the North Seas^^^Return to Handsome Terry to decipher what Zeh'gehn asked of you.^Is like dis
column2: mon. Ye be wantin' me 'elp spotting some craven bag-o-wire been cardin' da crew? Ye gotta bring me a croaker
column3: matey. Aft I an' I show ye who da blaggard be
column4: mon. Nah
column5: nah
column6: croaker show ye. Ye'll ku fer yerself with yer own deadlights
column7: yahso. Bring us a carver yahso too
column8: 'atsteppa. Galang
column9: bucko.
