column1: Trust is Earned^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Hidalgo the Master Falconer^Hidalgo the Master Falconer^Trust is Earned^Return to Valgarde^^Hidalgo at the Explorers' League Outpost in the Howling Fjord wants you to find a Fjord Grub and feed it to one of the falcons in the cage by his feet.^The first and most important factor in falconry is the bond between the falconer and <his/her> bird. Trust must be earned by the master! <Hidalgo points to the falcons in the cage at his feet.> If you are to earn their trust you will first need to fill their bellies. The fjord rock falcon
column2: as these birds are known
column3: primarily eat grubs. Throughout the fjord you will find loose rocks that serve as breeding grounds for these grubs. Find a grub and return here to feed the falcons in the cage.

column1: Gambling Debt^71^All^Howling Fjord^Taruk^Taruk^Gambling Debt^Forgotten Treasure^^Taruk at Scalawag Point wants you to collect "Silvermoon" Harry's Debt.^I heard you did a little work for Terry. I was hoping someone reliable would show up around these parts. See
column2: pirates love to gamble. They
column3: however
column4: do not love to pay their gambling debt. If you're interested in collecting some coin on my behalf
column5: I'd be willing to give you a cut. Let's start you out with an easy one. "Silvermoon" Harry's a bit of an eccentric
column6: keeps all sorts of expensive blood elf knickknacks inside his tent - yet when I see him he always pretends to be broke. Get my gold.

column1: The Ransacked Caravan^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Hidalgo the Master Falconer^Hidalgo the Master Falconer^Trust is Earned^^^Hidalgo at the Explorers' League Outpost in the Howling Fjord wants you to use the Trained Rock Falcon to recover 5 Fjord Turkeys.^I was leading a caravan here from Valgarde that was attacked by Dragonflayers. I was the only survivor of that ambush. Unfortunately
column2: I couldn't make it back here with the cargo of fjord turkeys. This is the perfect opportunity for you to get your feet wet with your rock falcon. <Hidalgo hands you a cage.> Take this falcon cage and head west down the road leading out of this camp. Use the falcon to capture the loose turkeys and return here when you've gathered enough. Remember to feed the falcon!

column1: Jack Likes His Drink^71^All^Howling Fjord^Taruk^Taruk^Gambling Debt^^^Taruk at Scalawag Point in Howling Fjord wants you to collect Jack Adams' Debt.^Our next customer
column2: Jack Adams
column3: won't be the pushover that Harry was. He spends all day drinking with his friends
column4: tough pirates all of them. Let's not use force this time
column5: could get ugly. See if you can use his drinking habit to your advantage. There's only so much alcohol someone can handle before passing out. Maybe one of the bar wenches will be of assistance. Once he's out
column6: see if you can slip your hand into his pocket and get what's mine.

column1: Dead Man's Debt^71^All^Howling Fjord^Taruk^Taruk^Gambling Debt^^^Taruk at Scalawag Point wants you to search for Black Conrad's Treasure on the plateau in the northeastern end of the Isle of Spears
column2: just north of Iskaal.^You might've heard of Black Conrad
column3: he's a famous pirate around these parts. Well
column4: he had a thing for gambling on my fights. He had a thing for not paying
column5: too. I'd love to collect
column6: but trouble is... he's dead. I was about ready to write the whole thing off
column7: when I came across this... <Taruk unfolds a map of the Isle of Spears with an X on a northeastern plateau.> He hid his treasure on tuskarr land. I want you to get it. I'll be damned if I let that bilge sucker get away without paying.

column1: Falcon Versus Hawk^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Hidalgo the Master Falconer^Hidalgo the Master Falconer^Trust is Earned^^^Hidalgo at the Explorers' League Outpost in the Howling Fjord wants you to use your Trained Rock Falcon to capture 10 Fjord Hawks.^Do you feel the closeness
column2: <name>? Surely you feel a true bond forming between you and your falcon. Would you believe me if I told you that when the time is right you'll be able to see through the eyes of your bird? Aye
column3: it is the ultimate level of falconry. But first you must hunt more! The bird must hone and quicken its reflexes. Send it against a more formidable opponent! The fjord hawks of the region make the tops of the trees around us their homes. They shall be your next target!

column1: Swabbin' Soap^71^All^Howling Fjord^Scuttle Frostprow^Scuttle Frostprow^^Street "Cred"^The Way to His Heart...^Scuttle Frostprow wants you to obtain Big Roy's Blubber as the main ingredient for her magic swabbin' soap. Return to her on the eastern pirate ship at Scalawag Point when you have it.^Yeah
column2: I got to get the deck swabbed spotless afore Mad Jonah comes 'round. An' I ain't gonna do it on my hands and knees neither! Problem is
column3: we're all outa soap. That's more your problem than mine though
column4: mate. Being the newbie 'round here
column5: I gots a special trip for ya to make. Up on the northwest coast of this island
column6: there's a whole mess o' sea lions. Amongst the nearby ice floes you'll find the alpha bull
column7: Big Roy. Bring me back his blubber and I'll magic-up the best soap ya ever seen!

column1: There Exists No Honor Among Birds^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Hidalgo the Master Falconer^Hidalgo the Master Falconer^Trust is Earned^^^Hidalgo at the Explorers' League Outpost in the Howling Fjord wants you to use your Trained Rock Falcon to capture 8 Fjord Hawk Eggs.^You are most definitely ready for the next step in falconry
column2: <name>. Take your trained falcon east of here
column3: to the vrykul hawk roost near the Stonewall Lift. From the roost you will send out your falcon to steal the eggs of the hawks. Their nests will be located in remote areas of the cliff walls surrounding the roost. Locate those nests and use your falcon to scavenge for the eggs! Beware the fjord hawk matriarchs
column4: <name>. Should you come under attack
column5: use your falcon's escape and soar abilities to flee!

column1: The Jig is Up^71^All^Howling Fjord^Annie Bonn^Annie Bonn^"Crowleg" Dan^^^Annie Bonn at Scalawag Point wants you to bring her Jonah Sterling's Spyglass.^I know why you're here
column2: <name>. You've been sent to kill our leader
column3: Jonah Sterling. I'd like to offer my help. Jonah's leadership threatens our operation. Attacking the Horde and the Alliance fleets simultaneously? Suicidal. Trying to sell the tuskarr as slaves when they die days after leaving this climate? Disastrous. Jonah's hideout is located inside a cave west of here. Bring me his spyglass as proof of the deed and my first action as lead will be to end all attacks against your allies.

column1: The Way to His Heart...^69^All^Howling Fjord^Anuniaq^Anuniaq^^Swabbin' Soap^^Toss Tasty Reef Fish at a Reef Bull to lead it to a Reef Cow. Once you have helped the two to find true love
column2: return to Anuniaq at Kamagua.^The Northsea Pirates slaughtered the isles' alpha sea lion bull
column3: Big Roy. They made soap from him to clean the decks of their ships! <Anuniaq sighs.> Now the sea lions won't mate. Help me to repopulate their numbers. The reef bulls can be found at the Twin Shores to the southeast. They crave the tasty reef fish that can be found on the east and west sides of the isles. Take this net and gather enough fish
column4: at least a dozen -- maybe more
column5: to lure a bull across the strait to a reef cow.

column1: A Traitor Among Us^71^All^Howling Fjord^Handsome Terry^Zeh'gehn^Pirates of the North Seas^^^Speak to Zeh'gehn at Scalawag Post.^Our second in command
column2: Annie Bonn
column3: has been acting rather paranoid as of late. She seems sure we have an infiltrator in our ranks
column4: can ye believe it? Anyhow
column5: we have a foolproof way of uncovering rats around these parts. See
column6: good ole' Zeh'gehn over here happens to be an authentic witch doctor. His family hails all the way from Zul... something or other. Go let him know that we're in need of his divination skills. I must warn ye
column7: <name>
column8: only one or two of us can understand anything Zeh'gehn says.

column1: Problems on the High Bluff^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Stanwad^Walt^The Human League^^^Speak with Walt.^As usual
column2: the real work is left up to me and my crew. Thankfully McSorf's team didn't die for nothin'. The cipher they recovered will help us crack the stuff we've found up here - that is if we can ever get back to it! Damned iron dwarves have sprung up like leaks all over the place and are now attemptin' to bury the sites! Can you believe it? Bastards want to bury our finds! Anyhow
column3: talk to Walt over yonder. He'll get you started.

column1: Tools to Get the Job Done^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Walt^Walt^The Human League^^We Can Rebuild It
column2: We Have the Technology^Walt at the Explorers' League Outpost in the Howling Fjord wants you to recover his Building Tools.^I've been studying this deactivated construct for days
column3: <name>. I think I can create a reasonable facsimile of the golem that would have room inside to fit one passenger. The idea being that it would fool those iron dwarves and allow us to get inside Baelgun's. Now I'm not gonna be able to make anything with a hammer and poker. I need my tools! Unfortunately I left those behind at Ivald's Ruin when the iron dwarves first attacked. Get me my tools! Ivald's Ruin is located far to the northeast.

column1: A Carver and a Croaker^71^All^Howling Fjord^Handsome Terry^Zeh'gehn^Pirates of the North Seas^^"Crowleg" Dan^Get a Shiny Knife from "Silvermoon" Harry and capture a Scalawag Frog. Bring these to Zeh'Gehn at Scalawag Point.^Some of the pirates around here... we have our own special way of talking. Zeh'gehn has... many different special ways of talking... all mixed together. From what I can tell he wants a frog and a knife. "Silvermoon" Harry might have a knife on the cheap. There's frogs all over town
column2: just grab one and bring it to him along with the knife. I'd hate to be in the poor critter's shoes
column3: if you know what I mean.

column1: Out of My Element?^70^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Donny^Donny^^Return to Valgarde^^Donny at Ivald's Ruin in the Howling Fjord wants you to kill 10 Iron Rune Destroyers
column2: 5 Iron Rune Laborers and 2 Iron Rune Sages.^Keep it down
column3: <race>. These iron dwarves are quick on the trigger. Now don't let the activities down in the dig fool you. Those steel-skinned abominations aren't digging anything up! No sir - on the contrary - they're burying the site! For whatever whacked out reason
column4: they don't want anyone finding this place. What kind of dwarf buries ancient relics and dig sites? I'll tell you what kind: the kind you kill with reckless abandon! Get in there and take 'em out!

column1: Outpost Over Yonder...^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Donny^Stanwad^^Return to Valgarde^^Deliver Donny's Letter to Stanwad at the Explorers' League Outpost.^I see that you haven't visited my brothers at the Explorers' League Outpost south of here. Why don't you do Donny a favor and deliver this message to Stanwad. He'll be interested to hear about the activities of the iron dwarves up here. Like I said
column2: mount up and start heading south. You'll see the outpost right before you get to Baelgun's.

column1: Crowleg Dan^71^All^Howling Fjord^Zeh'gehn^Handsome Terry^"Crowleg" Dan^A Carver and a Croaker^^Confront "Crowleg" Dan
column2: who is in one of the ships at Scalawag Point. Speak to Handsome Terry when you've completed this task.^Croaker's spoken
column3: matey. "Crowleg" Dan's on da ship yonder. Best go trace that blaggard
column4: mon. Show'im dis set's not fe be crossed. Gaan back fe Terry when ye keelhaul 'is behind.

column1: Meet Number Two^71^All^Howling Fjord^Handsome Terry^Annie Bonn^"Crowleg" Dan^^^Speak to Annie Bonn at Scalawag Point.^All the good work you've done for us hasn't gone unnoticed
column2: <name>. Our second in command
column3: the delightful Annie Bonn
column4: is incredibly impressed with what you've done so far and wants to meet you.

column1: Crisis at the Sunwell^70^All^Isle of Quel'Danas^Adyen the Lightwarden^Exarch Larethor^Crisis at the Sunwell^^^Adyen the Lightwarden on the Aldor Rise in Shattrath City has requested that you travel to Sunwell Plateau and speak with Larethor.^By the naaru
column2: I thank you
column3: <race>
column4: for your efforts. Our work is far from finished
column5: however
column6: and I must request that you undertake a critical mission - one as important as any I've issued. Our forces are spread thinly. To compound the strain
column7: we've had to dispatch a contingent to Azeroth to investigate developments at the Sunwell Plateau. You are needed there
column8: <name>. Report to Larethor. Tell him that I wish we could spare more men.

column1: Duty Calls^70^All^Isle of Quel'Danas^Dathris Sunstriker^Exarch Larethor^Duty Calls^^^Dathris Sunstriker on Scryer's Tier in Shattrath City has insisted that you travel to Azeroth at once and report to Larethor at the Sunwell.^Hear me
column2: <race>. Duty requires that you return to Azeroth. Every able person is to report to the Sunwell Plateau immediately. I'm afraid I have no more information to share
column3: except this: You'll be joining forces with the Aldor for this mission. Speak with a draenei by the name of Larethor when you arrive. Apparently
column4: the situation calls for us to set our differences aside and join forces. Prepare yourself
column5: friend. This sounds serious.

column1: We Can Rebuild It^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Walt^Walt^^Tools to Get the Job Done^Iron Rune Constructs and You: Rocket Jum^Walt at the Explorers' League Outpost in the Howling Fjord wants you to bring him a Large Barrel
column2: Industrial Strength Rope and Dark Iron Ingots.^Tools? Check. Materials? Negative. If we're going to build this thing
column3: you're going to have to get me the materials. First things first
column4: <name>. For the skeletal structure I'm going to need a large barrel from Nifflevar
column5: some dark iron ingots from Valgarde
column6: and industrial strength rope from Baleheim. Nifflevar and Baleheim are vrykul towns northwest of here. Valgarde is located in Daggercap Bay
column7: also to the northwest. Speak with McGoyver to get the ingots. He'll fly you back here once you're all done.

column1: We Have the Technology^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Walt^Walt^^Tools to Get the Job Done^Iron Rune Constructs and You: Rocket Jum^Walt at the Explorers' League Outpost in the Howling Fjord wants you to bring him a Pristine Shoveltusk Hide and Steel Ribbing.^While the infrastructure for a piece of machinery like this is important
column2: we can't underestimate the appearance of the construct. If we're to fool the iron dwarves the clone must be exact! I can make this happen. Bring me a pristine shoveltusk hide from the shoveltusk of this region and steel ribbing from vrykul in Nifflevar or Baleheim to the northwest.

column1: Iron Rune Constructs and You: Rocket Jumping^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Walt^Walt^Iron Rune Constructs and You: Rocket Jumping^We Can Rebuild It
column2: We Have the Technology^^Walt at the Explorers' League Outpost in the Howling Fjord wants you to use the Iron Rune Construct's Rocket Jump ability at Walt's Iron Rune Carving.^Alright
column3: <name>; the time has come for you to climb inside this thing and learn how to use its basic abilities. When you're ready
column4: get on the work bench and I'll get you situated inside the construct. Your first lesson is going to be using the construct's transportation system. You'll notice that the iron dwarves have set up special rune carvings around the dig site. Their constructs use those rune carvings to power up and fly from point to point. Try it with the rune carving I built here.

column1: Magisters' Terrace^70^All^Shattered Sun Offensive^Exarch Larethor^Tyrith^Crisis at the Sunwell^^^Exarch Larethor at the Shattered Sun Staging Area wants you to search Magisters' Terrace and find Tyrith
column2: a blood elf spy.^Welcome to the Sunwell
column3: <class>. Get yourself settled in and contribute however you can - there's much to do! Me? Yes
column4: I have a little something that needs doing
column5: but I'm not sure you're up to the task. We've had a contact embedded in Magisters' Terrace gathering intelligence for us. He's recently failed to report and I'm growing concerned. The terrace is just up the rise to the east. The information he was collecting is vital to our mission. Think you can handle it
column6: <race>?

column1: Iron Rune Constructs and You: Collecting Data^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Walt^Walt^Iron Rune Constructs and You: Rocket Jum^^^Walt at the Explorers' League Outpost in the Howling Fjord wants you to use the Iron Rune Construct's Collect Data ability while standing near the Iron Dwarf Relic.^The most important part of your job while controlling the construct is the collection of data. I've placed an iron dwarf relic in the cart over yonder. It's the floating
column2: lightning infused crystal. Get on the work bench and I'll put you back in the construct. Once you're back in the driver's seat
column3: use the construct's data collection ability to pick up the test data.

column1: The Scryer's Scryer^70^All^Shattered Sun Offensive^Tyrith^Kalecgos^Crisis at the Sunwell^^^Tyrith wants you to use the orb on the balcony in Magisters' Terrace.^<Tyrith winces in pain as he speaks.> Go to the terrace... use the orb. ...They're...feeding the sunwell....  <Tyrith gasps for breath.> Hurry... They must be stopped... before they can.... <Tyrith dies.>
Iron Rune Constructs and You: The Bluff^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Walt^Walt^Iron Rune Constructs and You: Rocket Jum^^Lightning Infused Relics
column2: The Delicate Sound of Thunder^Walt at the Explorers' League Outpost in the Howling Fjord wants you to use the Iron Rune Construct's Bluff ability on Lebronski after you've walked on his rug.^You always gotta have a contingency plan in case your main plan backfires! That's why I've built in some anti-intelligence systems into the construct. Your shiny new ride might rouse some suspicion while you're at Baelgun's excavation site. That's what your bluff ability is for! Just use that any time you're confronted and you'll be safe from harm. Test it out on Lebronski by walking on his rug. Once he starts huffin' and puffin'
column3: use the bluff! Get on the work bench when you're ready to begin.

column1: Hard to Kill^70^All^Isle of Quel'Danas^Kalecgos^Exarch Larethor^Crisis at the Sunwell^^Wanted: The Signet Ring of Prince Kael't^Kalecgos has asked you to defeat Kael'thas in Magisters' Terrace. You are to take Kael's head and report back to Larethor at the Shattered Sun Staging Area.^Welcome to the Sunwell
column2: mortals. Your arrival is indeed timely. As you've now witnessed
column3: the Legion forces work tirelessly
column4: manipulating the Sunwell's power to achieve their malevolent ends. Kael'thas has risen from the ashes of defeat and once more leads them in their efforts. Find him
column5: mortals. He must again be stopped. Other
column6: equally urgent matters require my immediate attention. I shall leave Kael's fate to you. Do not fail. With luck
column7: we shall speak again.

column1: Lightning Infused Relics^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Walt^Walt^^Iron Rune Constructs and You: The Bluff^News From the East^Walt at the Explorers' League Outpost in the Howling Fjord wants you to use the Iron Rune Construct's Collect Data ability to collect 15 sets of Iron Rune Data.^Your construct is ready to go. All abilities have been given a once over and I've programmed the machine to both comprehend and speak the language of the titans. Take the construct to Baelgun's Excavation Site
column2: due south of here
column3: and collect data from the lightning infused relics that litter the site. Remember to bluff any iron dwarves that suspect your construct to be a fake. And don't forget about rocket jumping from rune to rune to get around in there! Get on the table when you're ready!

column1: The Delicate Sound of Thunder^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Walt^Walt^^Iron Rune Constructs and You: The Bluff^News From the East^Walt at the Explorers' League Outpost in the Howling Fjord wants you to use the Iron Rune Construct to explore the thundering cave at Baelgun's Excavation Site.^The cavern that we opened at Baelgun's was the one place that most steered clear of... Can't say I blame 'em. The sound of thunder shot out of that cave
column2: <name>! Loud
column3: booming thunder! I think near the end
column4: it was abandoned by all. Bad
column5: bad things happened to any that went in to explore - most never coming back. I want you to check that cave out while you're at Baelgun's. Explore around the titan statue inside and report back with your findings.

column1: Learning to Fly^70^Alliance^Shadowmoon Valley^Nutral^Ilsa Blusterbrew^^^^Speak with Ilsa Blusterbrew at Wildhammer Stronghold in Shadowmoon Valley.^Though it may end up hurting my business in the long run
column2: you look the sort that dreams of flying <his /her> own mount through the skies
column3: rather than being flown from place to place. I understand the feeling completely. You
column4: my friend
column5: need to head to Wildhammer Stronghold in the southwest corner of Shadowmoon Valley. When you get there
column6: speak with Ilsa Blusterbrew about some flight instruction. Mind you
column7: her training's not cheap. But
column8: I think that you'll find it worth your while.

column1: Learning to Fly^70^Horde^Shadowmoon Valley^Nutral^Olrokk^^^^Speak with Olrokk at Shadowmoon Village in Shadowmoon Valley.^Though it may end up hurting my business in the long run
column2: you look the sort that dreams of flying <his /her> own mount through the skies
column3: rather than being flown from place to place. I understand the feeling completely. You
column4: my friend
column5: need to head to Shadowmoon Village in the northwest corner of Shadowmoon Valley. When you get there
column6: speak with Olrokk about some flight instruction. Mind you
column7: his training's not cheap. But
column8: I think that you'll find it worth your while.

column1: Wanted: The Signet Ring of Prince Kael'thas^70^All^Shattrath City^Wind Trader Zhareem^Wind Trader Zhareem^^Hard to Kill^^Wind Trader Zhareem has asked you to obtain The Signet Ring of Prince Kael'thas. Deliver it to him in Shattrath's Lower City to collect the reward.^<class>
column2: today I ask the impossible. Today
column3: you must obtain the signet ring of Kael'thas Sunstrider
column4: lord of the blood elves! It's true
column5: the rumors of his death within Tempest Keep were ill-founded. He has appeared once more
column6: this time at the Magisters' Terrace on the Isle of Quel'Danas. What he is doing there is a tale for someone else to tell you. What I know is that I have innumerable collectors interested in his princely ring
column7: and I mean to acquire it for them. Or rather
column8: I mean for you to do so.

column1: Wanted: Sisters of Torment^70^All^Shattrath City^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun^^^^Nether-Stalker Mah'duun wants you to slay 4 Sisters of Torment. Return to him in Shattrath's Lower City once you have done so in order to collect the bounty.^It has been whispered to Mah'duun that the sisters of torment are to be sent back to the hells from which they sprang. Mah'duun knows that these demons can be found at the Magisters' Terrace on the Isle of Quel'Danas. You will do this thing to earn the bounty
column2: or you will not.

column1: News From the East^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Walt^Captain Adams^^Lightning Infused Relics
column2: The Delicate Sound of Thunder^The Clutches of Evil^Speak with Captain Adams at Westguard Keep.^Westguard needs to know what's going on here
column3: <name>. I want you to personally deliver the news to Captain Adams. Whenever you're ready
column4: let me know and I'll put you back in the construct for one final flight. It'll take you to Westguard Keep
column5: but more than likely blow up in the process. It's been a pleasure...

column1: In Defense of Halaa^70^Alliance^Nagrand^Lakoor^Lakoor^^^^Defeat 10 enemy players in Halaa and return to Lakoor in Telaar.^We are not a warlike race
column2: <race>. However when war comes to our lands
column3: we do not run away from it. The Alliance and the Horde wage war in the city of Halaa
column4: to the northwest. We do not know what the blood elves are scheming
column5: but any victory for the Horde would be disastrous. The history between our people and the orcs is one of bloodshed and betrayal. Go and slay the enemy in Halaa and you will be rewarded in coin
column6: honor and renown.

column1: Enemies
column2: Old and New^70^Horde^Nagrand^Karrtog^Karrtog^^^^Defeat 10 enemy players in Halaa and return to Karrtog in Garadar.^Our ancient enemy
column3: the draenei
column4: have returned with powerful allies. They wage war in Halaa
column5: southwest of here. We cannot allow them a victory there as Garadar would be next without a doubt. Go and slay those who would aid our ancient enemy.

column1: The Dead Rise!^71^All^Howling Fjord^Orfus of Kamagua^Orfus of Kamagua^Orfus of Kamagua^^^Orfus of Kamagua at the Ancient Lift in the Howling Fjord wants you to find Fengir's Clue
column2: Rodin's Clue
column3: Isuldof's Clue and Windan's Clue.^The path east of us is a primary hunting trail of the tuskarr. At least that's what it used to be... More recently our hunters have been returning to Kamagua claiming that the dead have risen and are out for blood! That is what has brought my son and me here. Elder Atuik asks that we find resolution in the bluffs. Will you assist us in our time of need? I seek heroes willing to brave the perils of Shield Hill
column4: southeast of here. Search the desecrated graves for clues and return your findings to me.

column1: Spirits of Auchindoun^62^Alliance^Terokkar Forest^Exorcist Sullivan^Exorcist Sullivan^^^^Help the Alliance secure a tower in the Bone Wastes.^Auchindoun's spirits have no stake in the conflict between the Alliance and the Horde
column2: but incurring their favor will give our side an edge in the region. Ancient custom directs the living to pay their respects at spirit towers in the Bone Wastes - though only at specific times of the day. If you can help secure a tower during these times
column3: you will have helped bring the spirits to our side. Should we succeed in gaining the spirits' favor
column4: they will grant us a boon that will aid us in our endeavors.

column1: Spirits of Auchindoun^62^Horde^Terokkar Forest^Exorcist Vaisha^Exorcist Vaisha^^^^Help the Horde secure a Spirit Tower in the Bone Wastes.^The draenei might be our enemies
column2: but the spirits of their ancestors in Auchindoun are restless and have no allegiance. The draenei's custom required them to pay their respects at spirit towers at various times during the day. If you can help secure a tower during these times
column3: you will help the spirits return to peace in Auchindoun. The Alliance will try to capture the towers in order to secure the dead's favor. We must ensure that our side succeeds instead.

column1: Elder Atuik and Kamagua^71^All^Howling Fjord^Orfus of Kamagua^Elder Atuik^Orfus of Kamagua^^^Orfus of Kamagua in the Howling Fjord wants you to deliver Orfus's Bundle to Elder Atuik at Kamagua.^<Orfus bundles up the clues you brought him.> My people are bitterly entrenched in a war with the Northsea Freebooters. If any tuskarr could help us in our quest to right the wrongs of the pirates
column2: it will be Elder Atuik of Kamagua. You must take these clues to him at once. To get to Kamagua you must take the Ancient Lift
column3: behind me. Take the lift directly to Kamagua and find Elder Atuik.

column1: Grezzix Spindlesnap^71^All^Howling Fjord^Elder Atuik^Grezzix Spindlesnap^Orfus of Kamagua^^^Speak with Grezzix Spindlesnap.^The pirate thieves have set up port at Scalawag Point
column2: far to the south. Unfortunately
column3: they have fortified their camp with many deadly defenses. There is someone that might be able to assist us in infiltrating Scalawag. A pirate mercenary by the name of Grezzix Spindlesnap recently came to our village in search of food and shelter. In exchange he gives us information about our enemies and feeds them misinformation about our attack plans. Seek him out at his ship just off the coast here - southwest.

column1: Street "Cred"^71^All^Howling Fjord^Grezzix Spindlesnap^"Silvermoon" Harry^Orfus of Kamagua^^Forgotten Treasure
column2: Swabbin' Soap^Speak with "Silvermoon" Harry at Scalawag Point about the missing Vrykul artifacts.^The Northsea Freebooters all fear and respect Grezzix. I'm thinking they recognize my special talents and envy my amazing ship. All you need to do is tag along with my cabin boy
column3: Lou
column4: and you'll be in like... In like tin. Pirates love tin. Just talk to Lou when you're ready to go and he'll take you to Scalawag. Oh yea
column5: you'll want to talk to "Silvermoon" Harry first. He'll have more information on the stuff they pilfered. Just watch what you say around him. He's a freak... crazy for blood elves.

column1: Scoodles^71^All^Howling Fjord^"Silvermoon" Harry^"Silvermoon" Harry^Orfus of Kamagua^^The Staff of Storm's Fury
column2: The Frozen Heart of Isuldof
column3: The Lost Shield of the Aesirites
column4: The Ancient Armor of the Kvaldir^"Silvermoon" Harry at Scalawag Point wants you to recover his Sin'dorei Scrying Crystal from the orca
column5: "Scoodles."^One of the first things Jonah Sterling did after he went crazy was to take my prized sin'dorei scrying crystal and feed it to the bane of my existence
column6: "Scoodles" the orca. No I didn't name the damned thing. I just know that she swims out past the ships directly southeast of Scalawag. Kill that overinflated goldfish and rip out my beautiful sin'dorei crystal from its stomach. Do this and we can get down to business.

column1: The Staff of Storm's Fury^71^All^Howling Fjord^"Silvermoon" Harry^Orfus of Kamagua^^"Scoodles"^A Return to Resting^Recover the Staff of Storm's Fury and deliver it to Orfus of Kamagua in the Howling Fjord.^Those artifacts are cursed and you'd be crazy to go looking for them
column2: <race>. I know for certain that anyone that's come into direct contact with any of those items has either gone mad or been killed. Take that staff
column3: for example. Last I heard the ship that held it was abandoned and left to rot on the coast of the Isle of Spears
column4: north of here. If you want that thing
column5: check the ship's hold. Whatever you do
column6: don't bring that staff back here! And steer clear of Abdul! He'll tear your heart out.

column1: The Frozen Heart of Isuldof^71^All^Howling Fjord^"Silvermoon" Harry^Orfus of Kamagua^^"Scoodles"^A Return to Resting^Recover the Frozen Heart of Isuldof and deliver it to Orfus of Kamagua in the Howling Fjord.^Some say Jonah was never quite right in the head
column2: but I know the truth. It was the heart. That damned frozen heart! I saw the change in him the second he pulled it from the grave. I could see the blood freeze in his veins... It was then that the madness truly took over. He left us to hole up in his cave on the north side of this island. Last I heard he had thrown the heart in the back of his bear den. Too little
column3: too late... I'll kill you myself if you even think about bringing that heart back here!

column1: Maintaining the Sunwell Portal^70^All^Blade's Edge Mountains^Exarch Nasuun^Exarch Nasuun^^Report to Nasuun^^Obtain 10 Smuggled Mana Cells and return them to Exarch Nasuun on the Terrace of Light in Shattrath City.^We must maintain the energy to our portal or it will collapse. The mana cells that the ethereals at Bash'ir Landing have hidden will continue to serve our purposes. The landing sits atop the northwestern corner of the Blade's Edge Mountains
column2: far to the north. Remember
column3: acquire a phase device from one of the ethereals and then use it to locate the smuggled goods. Just be cautious of the phase wyrms that they use to guard the mana cells.

column1: Blood for Blood^70^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Magistrix Seyla^Magistrix Seyla^^The Missing Magistrix^^Magistrix Seyla at the Throne of Kil'jaeden wants you to kill 4 Emaciated Felbloods by using the Fel Siphon on them. You will need Demonic Blood from nearby Wrath Heralds to power the Fel Siphon.^When Kael's forces retreated through that portal
column2: his most loyal lackeys were rewarded with an abominable gift. They stayed behind and gorged themselves on the blood of demons for days. The blood has changed them
column3: given them new powers. It will also prove their undoing. Obtain blood samples from other demons. Use them to power this fel siphon and deprive these arrogant fools of their new powers. Slay them in their weakened state and return to me.

column1: Blast the Gateway^70^All^Hellfire Peninsula^Magistrix Seyla^Magistrix Seyla^^The Missing Magistrix^^Magistrix Seyla at the Throne of Kil'jaeden wants you to use the Sizzling Embers to summon a Living Flare and slay Incandescent Fel Sparks near it until it becomes an Unstable Living Flare. Return to the Legion Gateway with the Unstable Living Flare to destroy it.^We have to shut down this gateway to stop Legion reinforcements to the Isle of Quel'Danas. Take these embers
column2: they contain one of my creations: a living flare. It is designed to act as a powerful destructive force - as long as it has been provided enough energy. Find the fel sparks that wander the area and slay them near the living flare. The flare will grow in power each time
column3: until it becomes unstable. Once you've achieved this bring the flare to the gateway. It will know what to do.

column1: The Lost Shield of the Aesirites^71^All^Howling Fjord^"Silvermoon" Harry^Captain Ellis^The Lost Shield of the Aesirites^"Scoodles"^^Speak with Captain Ellis aboard the Sister Mercy.^If you listen real close you can hear cannon fire coming from the northeast. That's Captain Ellis's ship
column2: Sister Mercy. Thing is
column3: Ellis and his entire crew were killed 'bout a month ago. <Harry nods.> Ghost ship... If it's info you be wantin' 'bout the shield
column4: Ellis is the man to ask. Sister Mercy docks on the small island between here and Sorlof's Strand to pick up more souls for the ship's crew 'bout once every five minutes. There be no shortage of souls 'round these parts...

column1: Rediscovering Your Roots^70^All^Terokkar Forest^Mar'nah^Mar'nah^^^^Mar'nah at Sun's Reach Harbor wants you to travel to Razorthorn Rise in Outlands
column2: collect 5 Razorthorn Roots
column3: and return to her.^My stocks are presently sufficient
column4: but I'll need plenty of razorthorn roots to keep up with the demand. Collecting the roots is difficult
column5: but I know a special method of extraction. Using the glands of the Razorthorn flayers
column6: one can control a ravager there and use it to expose a root. To find the roots
column7: travel to Outlands and fly northeast from Shattrath until you reach Razorthorn Rise. Return to me
column8: <name>
column9: once you have collected five of the roots.

column1: Arm the Wards!^70^All^Isle of Quel'Danas^Captain Theris Dawnhearth^Captain Theris Dawnhearth^^^^Captain Theris Dawnhearth at the Shattered Sun Staging Area wants you to obtain 4 Mana Remnants from Wretched Fiends and Wretched Devourers and use them to energize one of the Crystal Wards surrounding the structures in Sun's Reach.^We've succeeded in reactivating the crystal wards around the sanctum
column2: but why stop there? We'll build defenses around the other structures
column3: but the Wretched are stubborn and continue to steal power from the crystal wards. Hunt them down and get the mana remnants they carry. Use the remnants to energize the sanctum wards; the safety of our operation depends on it.

column1: Further Conversions^70^All^Isle of Quel'Danas^Vindicator Xayann^Vindicator Xayann^^^^Vindicator Xayann at the Shattered Sun Staging Area wants you to place the Attuned Crystal Cores inside 5 defeated Erratic Sentries to turn them into friendly units.^My plan to replace the damaged crystals on the erratic sentries has been a success. We've managed to take the Sun's Reach Sanctum with their help. I've crafted new crystals that will bring more of them under our control; place them inside the hulls of defeated sentries. We'll deploy them to other locations once they're converted.
The Missing Magistrix^70^All^Isle of Quel'Danas^Captain Theris Dawnhearth^Magistrix Seyla^^^Blood for Blood
column2: Blast the Gateway^Use the Captured Legion Scroll near the portal at Dawning Square. Once you've gone through the portal
column3: find Magistrix Seyla.^We sent one of our operatives to investigate the fel portal in the middle of Dawning Square
column4: south of here. She never returned. Take this scroll we found on one of the enemy corpses. We believe it will grant you access through the portal. Once through
column5: find Magistrix Seyla and aid her in any way you can.

column1: Mutiny on the Mercy^71^All^Howling Fjord^Captain Ellis^Captain Ellis^The Lost Shield of the Aesirites^^^Captain Ellis aboard the Sister Mercy in the Howling Fjord has asked that you recover 5 Barrels of Blasting Powder from the ship's hold.^Aye
column2: we got problems
column3: matey. Me gunners have mutinied! M'n'the crew up top be tryin' to kick Sorlof's keester while dealin' with the mutinous gunners down'blo. Ye're gonna have to go down'blo and deal with those mutinous sea dogs and take their blastin' powder for the big'un o'er on the poop deck. With ye mannin' the big'un
column4: Sorlof is sure to die and give up the booty!

column1: Sorlof's Booty^71^All^Howling Fjord^Captain Ellis^Captain Ellis^The Lost Shield of the Aesirites^^^Slay Sorlof using the Big Gun and recover Sorlof's Booty. Return Sorlof's Booty to Captain Ellis aboard the Sister Mercy.^Me crew is gonna get the big'un all primed an'ready for ya
column2: matey. She's restin' snuggly on the bow
column3: o'er on the other side of the ship. Go'n man it and be ready to fire when Sorlof is in our sights! Once we take that landlubber down
column4: ye'll have to recover the booty for us
column5: seein' as how we can't leave the damned ship! Bring that booty back to me and ye'll get your cut - the shield...

column1: The Shield of the Aesirites^71^All^Howling Fjord^Captain Ellis^Orfus of Kamagua^The Lost Shield of the Aesirites^^A Return to Resting^Return the Shield of the Aesirites to Orfus of Kamagua at the Ancient Lift in the Howling Fjord.^Here's yer shield. Me hopes it doesn't curse ye like it did me'n'me crew. Ye don't have to go home
column2: but ye can't stay here... I be certain that thar be some that would be interested in getting' it back. Now get that thing off me ship!

column1: Strange Engine Part^70^All^Fishing^Strange Engine Part^K. Lee Smallfry^^^^Take the Strange Engine Part to K. Lee Smallfry in Telredor.^This strange engine part doesn't look like it fits in a steam pump
column2: much less anything else you've seen. Perhaps K. Lee Smallfry might know something about it.

column1: The Air Strikes Must Continue^70^All^Isle of Quel'Danas^Battlemage Arynna^Battlemage Arynna^^^^Battlemage Arynna wants you to speak to Ayren Cloudbreaker when you're ready to fly over the Dead Scar. Once there
column2: use the Arcane Charges to kill 2 Pit Overlords
column3: 3 Eredar Sorcerers and 12 Wrath Enforcers.^We've taken the armory from the enemy thanks to our aerial attacks against the Legion's forces in the Dead Scar. As a matter of fact
column4: it's gone so well that we're going to continue our air strikes against them. Take these arcane charges and use them against their forces. Talk to Ayren Cloudbreaker at the Sun's Reach Harbor when you're ready for flight.

column1: Report to Nasuun^70^All^Shattrath City^Tradesman Portanuus^Exarch Nasuun^^^Maintaining the Sunwell Portal^Tradesman Portanuus has asked you to speak with Exarch Nasuun on the Terrace of Light in Shattrath City.^I am most glad that you are here
column2: <class>! When we took this sanctum from the wretched
column3: we hurried to create a magical portal that leads here from Shattrath City in the Outland. My liege lord
column4: Exarch Nasuun
column5: is heading up the Offensive's efforts to maintain that portal. He asked me to send along any promising candidates who have what it takes to help with acquiring more energy to fuel it. Please
column6: travel to Shattrath City and speak with him inside A'dal's chamber on the Terrace of Light.

column1: Don't Stop Now....^70^All^Isle of Quel'Danas^Smith Hauthaa^Smith Hauthaa^^^^Smith Hauthaa in Sun's Reach Armory wants you to kill Darkspine Myrmidon to the east and use their keys to steal three pieces of the ore from their chests.^Now that we have an anvil
column2: I can really get to work. No matter how many supplies we receive
column3: I'll always be able to put the Darkspine Iron Ore to good use. We'll need a constant supply of weapons and armor if we're to be successful here. There are a group of naga on the coast to the east of here. They're collecting ore and placing it in chests for shipment to the Legion. Relieving them of their ore will help our efforts in more ways than one....

column1: The Battle Must Go On^70^All^Isle of Quel'Danas^Harbinger Inuuro^Harbinger Inuuro^^^^Harbinger Inuuro wants you to slay 6 Burning Legion Demons and the Emissary of Hate in Dawning Square. Use the Shattered Sun Banner to impale the Emissary of Hate's corpse.^We must continue to defeat and demoralize the armies of the Legion. The emissaries of hate are Legion shocktroopers deployed to reinforce tactical Legion positions. The enemy rallies around them for they fear them more than they fear us. Today we will change that. Take this banner and slay the demons of the Legion. When you meet the emissary
column2: slay and impale him.

column1: Crush the Dawnblade^70^All^Isle of Quel'Danas^Magister Ilastar^Magister Ilastar^^^^Magister Ilastar at Sun's Reach Armory wants you to slay 6 Dawnblade Summoners
column2: 6 Dawnblade Blood Knights and 3 Dawnblade Marksmen.^We've driven the Dawnblade army out of the Sun's Reach Harbor. Sun's Reach is ours in its entirety. Yet somehow... I'm not entirely satisfied. I want you to go to Dawnstar Village
column3: west of here
column4: and slay any surviving Dawnblade combatants. They sealed their fate when they followed Kael to this place.

column1: Disrupt the Greengill Coast^70^All^Isle of Quel'Danas^Captain Valindria^Captain Valindria^^^^Captain Valindria wants you to free 10 Greengill Slaves. Return to her onboard the Silvermoon's Pride at Sun's Reach Harbor once you have done so.^The naga have taken the Greengill Coast to the southeast. Their females
column2: the Darkspine sirens
column3: are using magic to enslave the indigenous murlocs. It's my responsibility to see to it that whatever the naga are up to over there is disrupted. That's where you come in. <class>
column4: I want you to get the controlling orbs from the female naga and throw them near the Greengill slaves
column5: breaking the orb and setting the murlocs free. My guess is that the murlocs will be incensed and turn on their masters.

column1: Keeping the Enemy at Bay^70^All^Isle of Quel'Danas^Vindicator Kaalan^Vindicator Kaalan^^^^Vindicator Kaalan at the Sun's Reach Armory wants you to speak to Ayren Cloudbreaker and fly over the Dawnblade reinforcement fleet. Use the Flaming Oil to set the ship sails on fire as you fly and once you land
column2: slay 6 Dawnblade Reservists.^We've managed to capture Sun's Reach in its entirety. Unfortunately a fleet of Dawnblade reservists is on its way to take back the harbor. Take this oil and secure a dragonhawk from Ayren Cloudbreaker. You should be able to fly within reach of the ships' sails; once you're close enough
column3: set them on fire. Land in one of the ships and attack the reservists. With their ship sails on fire they won't be able to mount much of a defense.

column1: Ata'mal Armaments^70^All^Shadowmoon Valley^Smith Hauthaa^Smith Hauthaa^^^^Smith Hauthaa needs you to produce 5 Cleansed Ata'mal Metal. Do so by breaking down Ata'mal Armaments on her anvil at the Sun's Reach Armory on the Isle of Quel'Danas.^The Ata'mal Terrace in eastern Shadowmoon Valley is holy to the draenei
column2: but is now overrun by fel orcs. They have dug up the special ore from that place and created corrupted weapons and armor. I need the armaments to form an alloy with the naga ore. Our anchorites have blessed my anvil with the ability to cleanse them. Retrieve the armaments from the Shadowmoon chosen
column3: slayers and darkweavers. Return them here
column4: breaking down and purifying them upon my anvil
column5: and then hand me the cleansed results.

column1: Open for Business^70^All^Isle of Quel'Danas^Mar'nah^Mar'nah^^^^Mar'nah at the Sun's Reach Harbor wants you to gather 5 Bloodberries from the bushes found on Quel'Danas.^Welcome
column2: <name>. There are a number of ways I can assist you in your efforts here. For example
column3: I've recently discovered a recipe for a unique elixir. The bloodberry grows wild in many regions of Azeroth and has long been considered nothing more than a nuisance. I've learned though
column4: that when exposed to the Sunwell's power this plant takes on special properties that can be distilled and imbibed to magnify one's abilites. Bring me a sample from the nearby bushes and I'll show you what I mean.

column1: Know Your Ley Lines^70^All^Isle of Quel'Danas^Astromancer Darnarian^Astromancer Darnarian^^^^Astromancer Darnarian in the Sun's Reach Sanctum wants you to use the Astromancer's Crystal at the Bloodcrystal
column2: the Dawning Square portal
column3: and the naga shrine at Greengill Coast.^Freeloaders! You all want instant gratification - never giving thought to the effort required to create even the simplest of portals. Perhaps a little education will instill a bit of gratitude for my ceaseless efforts. Take this crystal. Attune it to the Bloodcrystal to the west
column4: at the Dawning Square portal just south of here
column5: and at the naga shrine at Greengill Coast to the southeast. Perhaps then you'll appreciate your precious translocations....

column1: Your Continued Support^70^All^Isle of Quel'Danas^Anchorite Ayuri^Anchorite Ayuri^^^^Anchorite Ayuri at Sun's Reach in Sunwell Isle wants you to donate 10 gold.^We've built a memorial to honor those slain in battle. It's but a small consolation to the families that lost their loved ones. I am taking up a collection to aid the orphans and spouses of our war heroes. If you can spare a small donation it would go a long way.

A Magnanimous Benefactor^70^All^Isle of Quel'Danas^Anchorite Kairthos^Anchorite Kairthos^^^^Anchorite Kairthos wants you to donate 1000 gold to aid in Anchorite Ayuri's efforts. You will be known as <name> of the Shattered Sun if you complete this quest.^You've done so much for us
column2: <name>. We greatly appreciate your assistance. You might have noticed Anchorite Ayuri's efforts outside. She has a big heart and is very convincing
column3: but the donations do not quite add up to what she had expected. If you were to make a large contribution to her cause
column4: I will make sure that word of your deeds in this war spreads far and wide. What do you say?

column1: Enter
column2: the Deceiver...^70^All^Isle of Quel'Danas^General Tiras'alan^Archmage Ne'thul^^^^Report to Archmage Ne'thul on the Isle of Quel'Danas
column3: north of Quel'Thalas.^Despite our best efforts
column4: Kael'thas's sinister plans have been carried out. The Sunwell has been re-ignited in preparation for the Deceiver's arrival. The object that stands before me and below A'dal is a representation of the current status of the Sunwell's defenses. Mighty barriers have been raised
column5: stymieing our attacks against the inner chambers. If ever there were a time that our world needed assistance
column6: it would be now. Report to Archmage Ne'thul at the Isle of Quel'Danas
column7: north of Quel'Thalas.

column1: Winterfin Commerce^71^All^Borean Tundra^King Mrgl-Mrgl^Ahlurglgr^^Learning to Communicate^Oh Noes
column2: the Tadpoles!
column3: Them!^Collect 5 Winterfin Clams and deliver them to Ahlurglgr at Winterfin Retreat.^Now that you can speak with the Winterfin
column4: it is time for you to let them get to know you. One of the best ways to do that is to conduct business with them. The murlocs prize clams over any other object and their only surviving merchant is Ahlurglgr. If I were you
column5: I'd collect a handful of Winterfin clams and give them to him as a gift. The clams can be found all over down in the trench
column6: as well as across it in the Winterfin village and their caverns.

column1: Oh Noes
column2: the Tadpoles!^71^All^Borean Tundra^King Mrgl-Mrgl^King Mrgl-Mrgl^Oh Noes
column3: the Tadpoles!^Winterfin Commerce^^King Mrgl-Mrgl has asked you to rescue 20 Winterfin Tadpoles. Return to him at Winterfin Retreat once you have done so.^Oh good
column4: you're back! When the landslide at the village across the water exposed the caverns
column5: a malevolent lobstrok
column6: known as Claximus
column7: came out of the caves and stole the Winterfin tadpoles away. Something happened to all of the murlocs that followed him in there
column8: and when they re-emerged
column9: they were under his control. <class>
column10: you must swim across the waters and rescue the Winterfin tadpoles in the village and caverns. The future of the Winterfin tribe depends upon you!

column1: Them!^71^All^Borean Tundra^Brglmurgl^Brglmurgl^^Winterfin Commerce^^Brglmurgl at Winterfin Retreat has asked you to kill 15 Winterfin murlocs. Any combination of warriors
column2: oracles
column3: and shorestrikers will do.^Our brothers and sisters across the water are now our mortal enemies. They have kidnapped our tadpoles
column4: driven us out of our village
column5: and killed more of us than I can count. Prove yourself
column6: <race>! Swim across the rift and slay them! Despite the favor that the new king has shown you
column7: only then will we consider accepting you here. Fail to do so
column8: and you might as well leave now and never return!

column1: I'm Being Blackmailed By My Cleaner^71^All^Borean Tundra^King Mrgl-Mrgl^Mrmrglmr^Oh Noes
column2: the Tadpoles!^^^King Mrgl-Mrgl has asked you to speak with Mrmrglmr at the northwest end of Winterfin Retreat.^I have something embarrassing to admit: I'm being blackmailed! Mrmrglmr agreed to clean some of my things
column3: and got hold of my spare murloc costume. He's threatening to reveal my true nature to the other murlocs. I need not explain to you what a disaster that would be! Besides
column4: I have a plan that's going to require that we get that costume back. Please
column5: <name>
column6: go to Mrmrglmr at the other end of the Retreat to the north and do whatever he asks of you.

column1: Grmmurggll Mrllggrl Glrggl!!!^71^All^Borean Tundra^Mrmrglmr^Mrmrglmr^Oh Noes
column2: the Tadpoles!^^^Mrmrglmr wants you to return to him at Winterfin Retreat with Glrggl's Head.^If your pathetic little eyes were any good
column3: you'd see that we're being slaughtered by the orcas to the north in the bay! Assuming your precious night elf king wants his spare costume back
column4: I think you'll do me a favor and bring back the head of the king of the orcas
column5: Glrggl: he who swims against the tides of fate -- eradicating the hope of life for all those who hear the siren song of death upon the waves! Be quick about it
column6: <race>
column7: Winterfin murlocs are losing their lives even as we waste time talking!

column1: Succulent Orca Stew^71^All^Borean Tundra^Cleaver Bmurglbrm^Cleaver Bmurglbrm^^^^Cleaver Bmurglbrm has tasked you with acquiring 7 Succulent Orca Blubber. Return with them to him at Winterfin Retreat.^Word is
column2: strange <race>
column3: that you might be going after the king of the orcas
column4: Glrggl. That's all fine and good
column5: but if you want to taste the stew that makes life worth living
column6: then you'll bring me back the succulent blubber of the orcas that swim in Glimmer Bay. Hurry... I have quite a bit of cutting to do on this carcass if you want to reap the benefits of your efforts.

column1: The Spare Suit^71^All^Borean Tundra^Mrmrglmr^King Mrgl-Mrgl^Oh Noes
column2: the Tadpoles!^^^Return King Mrgl-Mrgl's Spare Suit to him at Winterfin Retreat.^Very well
column3: your king's secret is safe with me as long as he continues to help us against our enemies. Here
column4: take this to him. I cleaned it up nicely
column5: though I have no idea why he needs a second disguise. Maybe he has something in mind for you?

column1: Surrender... Not!^72^All^Borean Tundra^King Mrgl-Mrgl^King Mrgl-Mrgl^Oh Noes
column2: the Tadpoles!^^^King Mrgl-Mrgl at Winterfin Retreat has asked you to bring him a Claw of Claximus.^The time has come to put an end to this unnatural situation
column3: <name>. For the Winterfin murlocs to have a chance at a future
column4: Claximus must die! I want you to take my spare murloc suit and enter the Winterfin Caverns under the pretext of surrender. With the white flag in hand
column5: the murlocs won't attack you. You'll find him in the southwestern most corner of the caverns. Once you get close enough
column6: deal with Claximus. Bring me one of his claws as proof that the grisly deed has been done.

column1: The Ancient Armor of the Kvaldir^71^All^Howling Fjord^"Silvermoon" Harry^Orfus of Kamagua^^"Scoodles"^A Return to Resting^Recover the Ancient Armor of the Kvaldir and deliver it to Orfus of Kamagua in the Howling Fjord.^I was on the vessel that was bringing in the armor. We'd just boarded the ship and were headin' back here when we were attacked by a Forsaken destroyer. They boarded our ship
column2: took all the booty for themselves
column3: and then sunk her. That was the last I'd seen of that armor. If you want
column4: you can take my bomber from Scalawag to the dreaded isle that the destroyer be docked. Talk to my woman
column5: Alanya
column6: outside. She'll get you on the bomber. If you manage to find the stuff
column7: don't you dare bring it back!

column1: A Return to Resting^71^All^Howling Fjord^Orfus of Kamagua^Orfus of Kamagua^A Return to Resting^The Staff of Storm's Fury
column2: The Frozen Heart of Isuldof
column3: The Shield of the Aesirites
column4: The Ancient Armor of the Kvaldir^^Use the Bundle of Vrykul Artifacts at the ransacked burial mounds of Shield Hill to return the Frozen Heart of Isuldof
column5: the Shield of the Aesirites
column6: the Staff of Storm's Fury and the Ancient Armor of the Kvaldir.^<Orfus hands you a satchel.> Within this satchel are the artifacts that you recovered. Locate the burial mounds of Shield Hill
column7: far to the southeast
column8: where the items were originally stolen from and return the artifacts. It is my hope that this gesture will quell the spirits that now haunt our hunting grounds. Be strong
column9: <name>...

column1: Keymaster Urmgrgl^71^All^Borean Tundra^Glrglrglr^Glrglrglr^^^^Glrglrglr inside the Winterfin Caverns has asked you to retrieve Urmgrgl's Key.^I have to get out of these caverns! There's magic stuff seeping in from Coldarra
column2: above
column3: and affecting everyone's minds. I don't intend to be controlled like these others! Keymaster Urmgrgl is in the cave below and to the south. He holds the key to my cage. Get it from him and bring it back so that I can unlock my cage and get out of here. Hurry!

column1: Escape from the Winterfin Caverns^71^All^Borean Tundra^Lurgglbr^King Mrgl-Mrgl^^Learning to Communicate^^Escort Lurgglbr to safety and then report to King Mrgl-Mrgl at Winterfin Retreat with the good news.^The lock on my cage doesn't look too solid
column2: but I'm not foolish enough to try to leave without assistance. Will you help me safely get out of these caverns? There's no time to waste
column3: <race>. When you get back to the retreat
column4: please let the king know that I'm okay. He's sure to give you a reward.

column1: Learning to Communicate^71^All^Borean Tundra^King Mrgl-Mrgl^King Mrgl-Mrgl^King Mrgl-Mrgl^^Winterfin Commerce
column2: Escape from the Winterfin Caverns^King Mrgl-Mrgl has given you a conch to use upon Scalder's remains. Return The King's Filled Conch to him at Winterfin Retreat.^To help
column3: you must learn how to speak the Winterfin dialect. We'll work with the forces of nature and magic to do that. Take this empty conch shell. At the bottom of the watery trench below exists Scalder
column4: an elemental of air and watery fury. Once she is defeated
column5: use the conch upon her remains to capture her magical steam. Return the full conch to me
column6: and I'll imbue my knowledge of the Winterfin tongue into you. Luckily
column7: a friend taught me a water breathing spell
column8: which I will cast upon you.

column1: Return to Atuik^71^All^Howling Fjord^Orfus of Kamagua^Elder Atuik^A Return to Resting^^^Deliver the bad news to Elder Atuik at Kamagua.^Return to Elder Atuik at Kamagua. He and the rest of my people must be warned of this impending doom that approaches from the sea. <Orfus shivers.> Use the Ancient Lift to reach him. Please hurry!
Orfus of Kamagua^71^Alliance^Howling Fjord^Lunk-tusk^Orfus of Kamagua^Orfus of Kamagua^^^Find Orfus of Kamagua at the Ancient Lift in Howling Fjord.^Hail
column2: traveler. I am Lunk-tusk of the Kalu'ak. We are known as tuskarr to your people. My partner and I were recently sent up to investigate strange happenings along one of our hunting trails. It was when we approached the graveyard known as Shield Hill that we were attacked by the undead. I was lucky to make it to this camp
column3: but I am uncertain as to what became of Orfus. We parted ways at the Ancient Lift
column4: southeast of here along the cliff edge. Will you go see if he is ok?

column1: Too Close For Comfort^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Endorah^Librarian Donathan^Too Close For Comfort^Taking Back Mightstone Quarry^Prison Break^Endorah wants you to go to Amber Ledge north of Warsong Hold and thank those there for rescuing her.^I told them all that I remember. Why don't they believe me? I was gathering herbs by the rift. They came from nowhere
column2: dark wizards with magical beasts - I was surrounded! A magical box appeared above me
column3: opened up and pulled me inside. Just as it began to close around me
column4: my rescuers swooped in on the backs of red drakes. It was breathtaking! I never thanked them for saving me. Please
column5: <class>
column6: find them
column7: and pass on my gratitude.

column1: Nick of Time^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Midge^Librarian Donathan^Nick of Time^Plug the Sinkholes^Prison Break^Midge in Valiance Keep wants you to go to Amber Ledge to the north and thank those there for rescuing her.^I told them all that I remember. Why don't they believe me? I was gathering herbs by the rift. They came from nowhere
column2: dark wizards with magical beasts. I was surrounded! A huge magical cube appeared above me. It opened up and pulled me inside. I swear it's true! Just as it began to close around me
column3: my rescuers swooped in on the backs of drakes - It was amazing! My captors scattered and I was able to escape. I never thanked them for saving me. Please
column4: <class>
column5: if you see them
column6: pass on my gratitude.

column1: Monitoring the Rift: Cleftcliff Anomaly^71^All^Borean Tundra^Librarian Garren^Librarian Garren^Monitoring the Rift: Cleftcliff Anomaly^^^Garren on Amber Ledge wants you to use the Arcanometer at the Cleftcliff Anomaly.^Greetings
column2: <race>. I am Garren of Dalaran. Not long ago
column3: the rift was a peaceful place - geothermally speaking at least. Recently though
column4: earthquakes have occurred with alarming frequency and scars in the earth have appeared
column5: exposing unique energy fields of chaotic power. My mission here is to chart and monitor these anomalies. My instruments indicate that another has appeared on the cliff face to the southwest. Take this device with you and use it when you locate the new disruption.

column1: Monitoring the Rift: Sundered Chasm^71^All^Borean Tundra^Librarian Garren^Librarian Garren^Monitoring the Rift: Cleftcliff Anomaly^^^Garren at Amber Ledge wants you to use the Arcanometer at the Sundered Chasm anomaly and return to him with the readings.^Did you feel that?! That was just an aftershock... you should've been here a few minutes ago! I'm afraid I must call upon your services again. My instruments indicate that there is an immense disruption just west of here
column2: far beneath the water's surface. Just as before
column3: I need you to take the arcanometer and capture the anomaly's data. I'll cast a spell that will enable you to breathe underwater. If it wears off before you find it
column4: come let me know and I'll renew its effects.

column1: Hellscream's Vigil^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Warsong Recruitment Officer^Garrosh Hellscream^^^^Speak with Garrosh Hellscream in Warsong Hold.^Throm-Ka
column2: <race>! Welcome to Warsong Hold. My heart swells with pride to see that such a distinguished hero of the Horde has answered the call of duty! This impregnable fortress is a testament to the tenacity of the Horde. Through much we have battled to establish this foothold in Northrend. It is from here that our journey to Icecrown begins and it is through the leadership of the son of Hellscream that we will succeed! Garrosh awaits your arrival below. Lok'tar ogar!

column1: Hellscream's Vigil^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Warsong Recruitment Officer^Garrosh Hellscream^^^^Speak with Garrosh Hellscream in Warsong Hold.^Throm-Ka
column2: <race>! Welcome to Warsong Hold. My heart swells with pride to see that such a distinguished hero of the Horde has answered the call of duty! This impregnable fortress is a testament to the tenacity of the Horde. Through much we have battled to establish this foothold in Northrend. It is from here that our journey to Icecrown begins and it is through the leadership of the son of Hellscream that we will succeed! Garrosh awaits your arrival below. Lok'tar ogar!

column1: Prison Break^71^All^Borean Tundra^Librarian Donathan^Librarian Donathan^Too Close For Comfort^^^Librarian Donathan on Amber Ledge wants you to collect the Beryl Prison Key from one of the Beryl Mage Hunters at Beryl Point and use it to release a trapped mage from an arcane prison.^Greetings
column2: <class>. I am Donathan
column3: a loyal representative of Dalaran. Forgive my abruptness
column4: but we find ourselves in the midst of a crisis. Mages all across Azeroth are being abducted and I have been authorized to conscript anyone able to assist in the unraveling of this mystery. The camp just south of ours is where our investigation begins. I call upon you to rescue one of the imprisoned mages held there. You must obtain a key from one of the mage hunters and use it to open an arcane prison.

column1: Abduction^71^All^Borean Tundra^Librarian Donathan^Librarian Donathan^Too Close For Comfort^^^Donathan wants you to use the Arcane Binder on a wounded Beryl Sorcerer at Beryl Point and return to Amber Ledge with him.^<name>
column2: we have a situation. I've just learned that one of our archmages en route from Dalaran has gone missing. Naturally
column3: we suspect the mage hunters are behind her disappearance. Time is clearly of the essence. We must know what has become of Lady Evanor at once if we are to have any hope of rescuing her. Take this device. Return to Beryl Point and use it on a Beryl sorcerer when he is near death. It should bind him long enough for you to bring him here for questioning.

column1: Report to Steeljaw's Caravan^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Overlord Bor'gorok^Grunt Ragefist^^^^Speak with Grunt Ragefist at Steeljaw's Caravan.^That dimwitted cur
column2: Steeljaw
column3: tried to take our caravan of supplies on a shortcut through a taunka graveyard! We just struck up relations with them! Now the caravan lies in ruins
column4: overrun by the taunka spirits that rose out of their graves as he was trampling them. Head south and see if you can salvage the situation
column5: <class>. I sent Grunt Ragefist and a few others down there with him to help out. Why don't you see if you can lend a hand.

column1: We Strike!^72^Horde^Borean Tundra^Longrunner Proudhoof^Overlord Bor'gorok^^^^Help Longrunner Proudhoof and his Warsong raiders to survive the assault upon Steeljaw's Caravan and finish off the spirit of Force-Commander Steeljaw.^One of your orcs named Steeljaw tried to save some time by taking a shortcut through our burial grounds. This had better not be how your Horde normally acts
column2: <race>
column3: or you will find the taunka to be the end of you! But
column4: you look as if you want to help fix this situation. Good! Steeljaw's cursed spirit now haunts this place and disturbs the remains of my ancestors. We must put an end to him! If we live through this
column5: tell your Overlord Bor'gorok at the outpost to the north. Are you with me?

column1: We Strike!^72^Horde^Borean Tundra^Longrunner Proudhoof^Overlord Bor'gorok^^^^Help Longrunner Proudhoof and his Warsong raiders to survive the assault upon Steeljaw's Caravan and finish off the spirit of Force-Commander Steeljaw.^One of your orcs named Steeljaw tried to save some time by taking a shortcut through our burial grounds. This had better not be how your Horde normally acts
column2: <race>
column3: or you will find the taunka to be the end of you! But
column4: you look as if you want to help fix this situation. Good! Steeljaw's cursed spirit now haunts this place and disturbs the remains of my ancestors. We must put an end to him! If we live through this
column5: tell your Overlord Bor'gorok at the outpost to the north. Are you with me?

column1: Put Them to Rest^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Grunt Ragefist^Grunt Ragefist^^^^Put 20 taunka spirits
column2: either Ghostly Sages or Risen Longrunners
column3: to rest and then report back to Grunt Ragefist at Steeljaw's Caravan.^Force-Commander Steeljaw's idiocy caused this mess. What was he thinking taking a caravan through a taunka burial mound? Still
column4: what's done is done. Now it is up to us to deal with the consequences. Overlord Bor'gorok asked me to help Longrunner Proudhoof in any way that I can. The longrunner has asked that we lay to rest the spirits of his ancestors. What do you say
column5: <class>? Are you <man /strong> enough to handle such a simple task?

column1: The Defense of Warsong Hold^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^High Overlord Saurfang^Overlord Razgor^The Defense of Warsong Hold^^Taking Back Mightstone Quarry^Report to Overlord Razgor at the hut on the south side of Warsong Hold.^Hellscream has the weight of the Horde upon his shoulders. Do not be dissuaded from your duties because of his temperament
column2: <name>. <Saurfang nods.> Did you think that I would forget the name of a hero of Orgrimmar? It is not every day that I have the pleasure of putting the head of Nefarian on a pike! The Scourge have begun their assault upon this fortress. Our soldiers steady the line
column3: but are in desperate need of backup. Report to Razgor. He is stationed directly outside of Warsong Hold.

column1: The Defense of Warsong Hold^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^High Overlord Saurfang^Overlord Razgor^The Defense of Warsong Hold^^Taking Back Mightstone Quarry^Report to Overlord Razgor at the hut on the south side of Warsong Hold.^Do not let Hellscream dissuade you from your duties as a soldier of the Horde
column2: <race>. He bears a terrible burden in these frozen wastes
column3: with the outcome of his charge resulting in victory over the Scourge or the extinction of all life on Azeroth. It is for this reason that we require your strength and wisdom. The Scourge have begun their assault upon this fortress. Our soldiers steady the line
column4: but are in desperate need of backup. Report to Razgor. He is stationed directly outside of Warsong Hold.

column1: The Defense of Warsong Hold^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^High Overlord Saurfang^Overlord Razgor^The Defense of Warsong Hold^^Taking Back Mightstone Quarry^Report to Overlord Razgor at the hut on the south side of Warsong Hold.^It seems that we always meet in the direst of circumstances
column2: Scarab Lord. Were you not saving the world from certain destruction the last time we met? <Saurfang chuckles.> Your assistance is most welcome in Northrend
column3: despite what the young chieftain might say. If we had even a dozen more soldiers with your power
column4: we would be sitting in Orgrimmar right now
column5: hunched over a warm fire. Report to Overlord Razgor
column6: right outside the main entry to Warsong Hold
column7: to the south.

column1: Taking Back Mightstone Quarry^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Overlord Razgor^Overlord Razgor^The Defense of Warsong Hold^^Too Close For Comfort
column2: Untold Truths
column3: Ride to Taunka'le Village^Overlord Razgor at Warsong Hold wants you to kill 15 Nerub'ar Nerubians.^While Warsong is protected by 10 feet of steel and stone on all sides
column4: this quarry is soft and primed for attacks by the Nerubians. <Razgor points west.> Beyond this quarry stand thousands of Scourge
column5: awaiting orders to attack. Should the Nerubians take down our inner defenses
column6: we will be overrun by the undead legions of Arthas. We can't let that happen - which is why you're going on the offensive and slaughtering the Nerubians in the quarry. Blood and thunder
column7: soldier! Take 'em both with you.

column1: Thassarian
column2: My Brother^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Leryssa^William Allerton^Word on the Street^^^Look for William Allerton inside the Farshire mine.^I recently received word from William Allerton
column3: a family friend
column4: that my brother enlisted here in Valiance Keep on the same day he did. Thing is... my brother's been dead for years. I sold everything I owned to come looking for Thassarian
column5: only to be stonewalled by the local bureaucracy. I've even been threatened with arrest if I keep snooping around. I need someone in the good graces of the higher-ups... someone like you. If you can help me
column6: I heard that William's stationed at the Farshire mine.

column1: The Late William Allerton^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^William Allerton^Leryssa^Word on the Street^^^Bring the Enlistment Card to Leryssa at Valiance Keep in Borean Tundra.^William's neck has been cut by a sharp object. Further inspection reveals a single clue to bring to Leryssa - an enlistment card bearing the name of William Allerton.

Lost and Found^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Leryssa^James Deacon^Word on the Street^^^Speak to James Deacon at the inn in Valiance Keep.^Poor Mr. Allerton might yet help us find my brother. <Leryssa unveils a voluminous book
column2: not unlike an army recruitment ledger.> I borrowed it
column3: ok? Let's see
column4: does that enlistment card have a date? William saw Thassarian at the enlistment line. Their entries must be near each other... here it is! He was assigned to... Unit S? All the other military units are named after Alliance towns. Who's in the unit? Where are they deployed? We need rumors. See if the innkeeper's heard anything.

column1: Cutting Off the Source^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Overlord Razgor^Overlord Razgor^The Defense of Warsong Hold^^^Overlord Razgor at Warsong Hold wants you to destroy 10 Nerub'ar Egg Sacs.^Aerial reconnaissance of the quarry reports that the Nerubians are storing their eggs on the scaffolding surrounding the base. Smart beasts these are... They're keeping the eggs high and dry
column2: away from the epicenter of conflict. You're going to have to go back out there and track down their eggs. Find 'em
column3: smash 'em
column4: and trash 'em. Each egg destroyed means twenty less Nerubians feeding on our corpses.

column1: In Wine
column2: Truth^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^James Deacon^Old Man Colburn^Word on the Street^^^Salvage a bottle of Kul Tiras Wine from the underwater shipwreck northeast of Valiance Keep and bring it to Old Man Colburn in the Valiance Keep inn.^The military was all that old man Colburn had. After he retired
column3: he still clung to it like a lifeline. He knows the name of every general
column4: unit
column5: brigade
column6: detachment... you name it. He's the man you need. Problem is
column7: his mind is scarred. He won't talk to anyone unless he gets his Kul Tiras wine. Takes him back to the times he was a marine. I haven't received a shipment in months. The last merchant ship out of Kul Tiras sunk northeast of here. See if you can salvage a bottle to bring Colburn.

column1: A Deserter^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Old Man Colburn^Private Brau^Word on the Street^^^Find the prison inside Inner Hold in Valiance Keep and speak to the deserter.^Unit S... Unit S.... hmmmpph.... don't make any sense... it oughta be named after a town... Darkshire was sent to Dragonblight. The Goldshire boys were sent to the Fjord. Where did I hear... Oh
column2: yes... the deserter! There's a turn-tail in the barracks prison. Got thrown in not too long ago. Kept saying that "S" stood for suicide. Look for the deserter. He might have some information for you.

column1: The Honored Ancestors^72^All^Borean Tundra^Elder Atkanok^Elder Atkanok^The Honored Ancestors^^^Elder Atkanok outside Coldrock Quarry wants you to identify the statues of Elder Kesuk
column2: Elder Sagani
column3: and Elder Takret.^<A distant voice echoes in your head as you regard the stone statue.> Do not be startled
column4: stranger. I am Elder Atkanok
column5: an ancient ancestor of the tuskarr people
column6: a skilled craftsman in my own time and the guardian of this quarry for centuries. The quarry has been overrun
column7: leaving many statues unfinished while the ancestors' spirits wander the world. Will you aid me in righting this wrong? First
column8: I must know the names of these wandering ancestors. Look for the markers near their statues.

column1: Patience is a Virtue that We Don't Need^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Quartermaster Holgoth^Quartermaster Holgoth^Patience is a Virtue that We Don't Need^^^Quartermaster Holgoth at Warsong Hold wants you to recover 15 crates of Warsong Munitions.^We can kill all the Nerubians that we see and destroy all the eggs that we find
column2: but those things won't stop coming until we blow their tunnels and passageways up. Of course
column3: we can't do that without some heavy grade munitions. Unfortunately
column4: most of our stockpile is being used up by the goblins and blacksmiths for our siege tanks and weaponry. We do happen to have a pretty good supply of the stuff out in Mightstone Quarry - underneath all the Nerubian crap. You'll just have to go out and get it for me.

column1: The Lost Spirits^72^All^Borean Tundra^Elder Atkanok^Elder Atkanok^The Honored Ancestors^^^Elder Atkanok
column2: on the outskirts of Coldrock Quarry
column3: wants you to free the spirits of 3 Kaskala Craftsmen and 3 Kaskala Shaman.^In the attack on the quarry
column4: the shaman and craftsmen working here were slain. The violence threw the spirit world into utter chaos and we'll be unable to guide the ancestors home unless we find a way to soothe the spirits of the murdered. The aggressors themselves pay no heed to the spirits
column5: but their companions
column6: the beryl hounds
column7: sense the spirits and hold them in thrall. Kill the beryl hounds
column8: and using the raw energy left behind
column9: break the imprisonment of the spirits of the innocent.

column1: Bury Those Cockroaches!^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Quartermaster Holgoth^Quartermaster Holgoth^Patience is a Virtue that We Don't Need^^^Quartermaster Holgoth at Warsong Hold wants you to use the Seaforium Depth Charge Bundle to destroy the Nerub'ar sinkholes to the south
column2: east
column3: west and north of Warsong Hold.^North
column4: south
column5: east and west. Those are the locations that you should be concerned about. Surrounding this fortress
column6: within Mightstone Quarry
column7: are four perfectly situated Nerub'ar sinkholes. <Holgoth hands you a bundle.> Be very careful with that package
column8: <name>. Mishandle it and you'll be dog meat. Inside the bundle are seaforium depth charges. Get to each of those Nerub'ar sinkholes and plant a depth charge at their center point. If all goes well
column9: the tunnels will collapse. Get a move on!

column1: Picking Up the Pieces^72^All^Borean Tundra^Elder Atkanok^Elder Atkanok^The Honored Ancestors^^^Bring 6 Tuskarr Ritual Objects to Elder Atkanok
column2: who stands outside Coldrock Quarry.^With the spirits of the murdered craftsmen and shaman at rest
column3: the way is clear for us to complete the ceremonies interrupted by the attack. You must perform a role traditionally reserved for a tuskarr shaman
column4: and you must possess all the necessary ritual items. There is no time to craft new ones
column5: so you will need to scour the quarry for those left by the victims of the attack. Handle these objects with care
column6: <name>
column7: for some are centuries old. You may need to wrest them from the hands of the invaders.

column1: Leading the Ancestors Home^72^All^Borean Tundra^Elder Atkanok^Elder Atkanok^The Honored Ancestors^^^Elder Atkanok wants you to guide the spirits of Elder Kesuk
column2: Elder Sagani
column3: and Elder Takret to their stone monuments.^With your help
column4: the ancestor spirits can now be guided to their rightful homes
column5: the statues lovingly prepared by Kaskala's craftsmen and shaman. The ceremonies for these ancestors were interrupted during the attack on the quarry
column6: and you will need to complete them. Take with you the objects that you recovered from the quarry
column7: stand in front of the statues with the name markers
column8: and recite this chant. <Words in a strange language flood your head
column9: but you have no difficulty recalling them.>

column1: Taken by the Scourge^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Foreman Mortuus^Foreman Mortuus^^^^Foreman Mortuus at Warsong Hold wants you to free 5 Warsong Peons.^<Mortuus sighs.> Peons... We may as well post up a sign offering the Nerub'ar a free meal. See
column2: the problem with a peon is that: (1) they're dumber than dirt; and (2) they're weaker than a leper gnome. Of course they're the first to be taken by the Scourge! This puts me in a bit of a predicament
column3: you see. Without peons
column4: manual labor comes to a halt. No peons
column5: no construction. Find and release my peons
column6: <race>. If they're alive
column7: you'll find 'em spun up in webbing throughout Mightstone Quarry.

column1: Reclaiming the Quarry^72^All^Borean Tundra^Etaruk^Etaruk^Reclaiming the Quarry^^^Etaruk
column2: camped near the entrance to the Coldrock Quarry
column3: wants you to kill 12 Beryl Treasure Hunters.^You're a welcome sight
column4: <class>. My name is Etaruk
column5: and I used to be a craftsman here at the Coldrock Quarry. My companions and I were preparing a new set of statues for their last set of rites when we saw those mysterious blue platforms come flying over the plateau. When they landed
column6: the mages they carried swarmed the quarry
column7: murdering my fellows and plundering the quarry. If we don't stop them
column8: they'll destroy our statues and make off with our artifacts. Will you help me defeat the invaders?
