column1: Karuk's Oath^71^All^Borean Tundra^Karuk^Karuk^A Diplomatic Mission^^^Karuk wants you to slay 6 Skadir Raiders and 5 Skadir Longboatsmen.^They call themselves the Kvaldir. My people have legends about them; we call them the tuk-hariq - walkers of the fog. My village was destroyed by these giant mist-men. Everyone I knew was slain
column2: including my father Ariut. By tuskarr law I must seek retribution against those who shed my kin's blood. I am but a fisherman and I've not yet passed the test of manhood... I cannot stand toe-to-toe with the vile Kvaldir. If you were to carry out my blood duty for me
column3: I will be in great debt to you.

column1: Untold Truths^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Shadowstalker Barthus^Shadowstalker Luther^Untold Truths^Taking Back Mightstone Quarry^^Find Shadowstalker Luther in Mightstone Quarry.^We are here by order of Varimathras! The mission of the Shadowstalkers is a simple one: spy. Well
column2: spy with a little assassination on the side. One of my best field agents has gone missing. I haven't heard from him in days
column3: which has left me fearing the worst. No
column4: not death! Death would be ideal. I fear he may have gone rogue... turned traitor even. His last known location was northern Mightstone Quarry. He was gathering intelligence on the Nerubians. Find him. He better be dead...

column1: Nerub'ar Secrets^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Shadowstalker Luther^Shadowstalker Barthus^Untold Truths^^^Take Luther's Journal to Shadowstalker Barthus at Warsong Hold.^You skim through the pages of the book
column2: looking for anything of importance. On the last page you discover what appears to be frantic scribbling: Necrolords. At least a dozen by my count. Farms to west being used as some sort of horrible spawning glade for Scourge. Row upon row of victims. I think they're on to me. Made a dash for the hold. I won't be captured alive. Dreadvenom hemotoxin. If they decide to bite into me
column3: they'll be in for a surprise. Take this information back to Barthus.

column1: Message to Hellscream^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Shadowstalker Barthus^Garrosh Hellscream^Untold Truths^^^Take Barthus's Note to Garrosh Hellscream at Warsong Hold.^<Barthus tears out the last page and rolls it up.> Take this to Hellscream at once! In the meantime
column2: I'm going to send a team to scout out the farms. Be sure to tell Hellscream that we're going to need reinforcements.

column1: Hampering Their Escape^72^All^Borean Tundra^Etaruk^Etaruk^Reclaiming the Quarry^^^Etaruk
column2: outside the Coldrock Quarry
column3: wants you to destroy the North Platform
column4: the East Platform
column5: and the West Platform.^I'm sure you've seen those blue and white platforms hovering over the quarry. They're the transportation the mage hunters used to land their forces here
column6: and now they're loading them up with our artifacts and fragments of our statues. We must stop them before they leave the quarry. The small creatures digging in the quarry carry explosives. Take them and use them to destroy the three floating platforms. The leader keeps watch from a fourth
column7: grounded platform
column8: but we'll deal with him afterward.

column1: Reinforcements Incoming...^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Garrosh Hellscream^Shadowstalker Ickoris^Untold Truths^^Merciful Freedom
column2: Damned Filthy Swine^Seek out Shadowstalker Ickoris at the Warsong Farms Outpost west of Warsong Hold.^<Hellscream shakes his head.> You may not have noticed that we're trying to win a war here
column3: <race>. I need all available soldiers at the primary points of conflict. This means that we don't have any real soldiers to spare for these minor incursions. <Hellscream pauses to think.> If Barthus wants reinforcements at the farm... <Hellscream claps his hands together.> ...he shall have them! Report to Barthus's assassins at the farms
column4: west of here. Let them know that reinforcements have arrived.

column1: Gamel the Cruel^71^All^Borean Tundra^Karuk^Karuk^A Diplomatic Mission^^A Father's Words^Karuk wants you to defeat Gamel the Cruel at Riplash Strand.^My own father was slain by the leader of this raiding party
column2: Gamel the Cruel. He has made his abode inside a cave on the beach. You've dealt with his men already. Finish what you've started
column3: <name>. Avenge my father and I will share with you what little I still have.

column1: A Father's Words^71^All^Borean Tundra^Karuk^Veehja^A Father's Words^Gamel the Cruel^^Look for Veehja at the Shrine of Scales on Riplash Strand.^There is someone who might shed light on this mystery
column2: <race>. It is rumored that the Kvaldir have kept a naga priestess alive at the temple on the west side of the shore. She will no doubt have great reason to resent her uninvited Kvaldir guests. Perhaps my father is expecting her to cooperate with you in some way.

column1: A Visit to the Curator^72^All^Borean Tundra^Etaruk^Etaruk^Reclaiming the Quarry^^^Etaruk
column2: on the outskirts of the Coldrock Quarry
column3: wants you to kill Curator Insivius.^The leader of the mage hunter forces is a fearsome creature called Curator Insivius. My people have hunted the beasts of the seas and land for countless generations
column4: but I've never seen anything like this curator before. He's landed one of those flying disks on the upper rim of the quarry and oversees the operation from there. <name>
column5: I can only believe the ancestors themselves sent you to my rescue and I hope you will help me drive the mage hunters from this quarry once and for all.

column1: The Sky Will Know^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Spirit Talker Snarlfang^Imperean^To Bor'gorok Outpost
column2: Quickly!^^^Speak with Imperean at the Ruins of Eldra'nath.^I must find out what happened to my master
column3: Farseer Grimwalker! Earlier
column4: he was observing the magnataur at nearby Magmoth. But one of his grunts just returned
column5: saying that the group had been crushed
column6: and that the farseer was dragged into the depths of the place. Before I send you on a suicide mission
column7: I wish to consult with the spirits to learn more. There is an air elemental known as Imperean in the ruins of Eldra'nath to the west. She is wise and may give you the information we seek.

column1: The Trident of Naz'jan^71^All^Borean Tundra^Veehja^Veehja^A Father's Words^^^Veehja in Riplash wants you to go to the far northeastern end of the Riplash Ruins. Once there slay Ragnar Drakkarlund and obtain the Trident of Naz'jan from him.^Five hundred years ago
column2: Azshara imprisoned a being named Leviroth in the waters below. Now these barbarians seek to undo our queen's work! They took over our city and began to sacrifice my brethren to awaken him! When they ran out of naga
column3: they began to take tuskarr. Their spirits will know no peace! I will help you
column4: for it will go a long way towards quelling my vengeance. Their captain
column5: Ragnar
column6: dwells deep inside northeastern Riplash. He has in his possession a golden trident. Bring it to me!

column1: The Emissary^71^All^Borean Tundra^Veehja^Karuk^A Father's Words^^^Find Leviroth in the waters below the iceberg floating among the northern edge of Riplash Ruins. Use the Trident of Naz'jan to slay him and return to Karuk to the north of Riplash Strand.^Raj Naz'jan was the emperor of Riplash when Leviroth was imprisoned. Azshara herself blessed his trident so it would slay the beast should it ever escape. Now you wield it
column2: <race>. As much as it disgusts me
column3: I will have my revenge on these barbaric giant-men. Take the trident to the depths beneath Riplash. You will find Leviroth below an iceberg closest to northern Riplash. Drive the trident into his flesh and slay him! Return to whomever sent you when you're done; I wish to see no more of you.

column1: Boiling Point^72^Horde^Borean Tundra^Imperean^Imperean^To Bor'gorok Outpost
column2: Quickly!^^^Imperean wants you to beat Simmer and Churn into submission. Return to her at the Ruins of Eldra'nath when they have submitted.^Ah
column3: it is information that you crave: the whereabouts and condition of your 'farseer'. He did not see so far as to avoid the trouble which befell him. Nevertheless
column4: I will give you the means to acquire the knowledge. But first
column5: you will do some things for me. No doubt you have seen the war between fire and water to the south. Simmer keeps boiling Churn's pool
column6: and the two have been battling for ages. Go to the Charred Rise and Blistering Pool
column7: and convince each of them to stop their bickering.

column1: Shrouds of the Scourge^72^Horde^Borean Tundra^Chieftain Wintergale^Chieftain Wintergale^Shrouds of the Scourge^Patching Up^^Chieftain Wintergale at Taunka'le Village wants you to bring him 5 Scourged Mammoth Pelts.^To the northeast looms the Temple City of En'kilah
column2: the Scourge's seat in Borean Tundra. From behind its walls
column3: the Scourge commander has sent his Nerubians to surround us. Remaining on the defensive would doom my people
column4: but my advisors differ in their strategies. Durm would charge in blindly
column5: while Sage Aeire favors stealth. The Temple City has blighted the nearby lands and the native creatures. Aeire believes the pelts of the scourged mammoths can serve as a cloak that may hide an infiltrator.

column1: Return to the Spirit Talker^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Imperean^Spirit Talker Snarlfang^To Bor'gorok Outpost
column2: Quickly!^^^Deliver Imperean's Primal to Spirit Talker Snarlfang at Bor'gorok Outpost.^You have done what was asked
column3: and now I give you that which you desire. Deliver this primal to the spirit talker back at your Bor'gorok Outpost. If she is wise
column4: she will know a ritual to gain you the information which you seek.

column1: The Bad Earth^72^Horde^Borean Tundra^Chieftain Wintergale^Chieftain Wintergale^Shrouds of the Scourge^^^Bring 8 clods of Scourged Earth to Chieftain Wintergale at Taunka'le Village.^By curing the hides with the blighted earth outside the Temple City
column2: Sage Aeire believes she can create a cloak which will cause most of the Scourge minions to ignore your presence. You should blend right in
column3: she says. She'd best be correct. It's our only chance to gather information and plan our counterattack. You should be able to find the earth she needs poking in the areas to the south and west of the fortress. Bring it to me when you've finished gathering it.

column1: Vision of Air^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Spirit Talker Snarlfang^Spirit Talker Snarlfang^To Bor'gorok Outpost
column2: Quickly!^^Farseer Grimwalker's Spirit
column3: Revenge Upon Magmoth^Use Imperean's Primal to perform a ritual at Snarlfang's Totem at Bor'gorok Outpost to gain information concerning Farseer Grimwalker.^Here
column4: <name>
column5: I've attuned the primal to you. Open your soul to it in the presence of my totem of air and concentrate upon the fate of Farseer Grimwalker. The spirit of the wind touches all; with any luck you will be granted a vision.

column1: What the Cold Wind Brings...^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Ith'rix's Hardened Carapace^High Overlord Saurfang^^^^Take Ith'rix's Hardened Carapace to High Overlord Saurfang at Warsong Hold.^You hold the carapace fragment of Ith'rix the Harvester and realize that this is only the beginning. Even now you sense that victory is fleeting. Surely the Lich King has a thousand more beasts like Ith'rix
column2: waiting to be unleashed upon the Horde. Take your trophy and present it to High Overlord Saurfang
column3: inside Warsong Hold. He should be notified of your victory over a powerful Scourge agent.

column1: Blending In^72^Horde^Borean Tundra^Chieftain Wintergale^Chieftain Wintergale^Shrouds of the Scourge^^A Courageous Strike
column2: Neutralizing the Cauldrons^Chieftain Wintergale at Taunka'le Village wants you to wear the Imbued Scourge Shroud in the Temple City of En'kilah and scout the Spire of Blood
column3: the Spire of Pain
column4: and the Spire of Decay.^Sage Aeire has finished the shroud. Take it with you and travel to the Temple City of En'kilah. Don the cloak within the city's bounds to hide yourself from most of the Scourge there. This will be our best opportunity to gather information about the enemy's fortifications and leaders. While wearing the cloak
column5: scout the three large spires on the grounds of the city. While the shroud will shield you from most of the Scourge
column6: the En'kilah abominations will be able to find you if you get too close.

column1: Wind Master To'bor^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Overlord Razgor^Wind Master To'bor^The Defense of Warsong Hold^^^Report to Wind Master To'bor at Warsong Hold.^You're a tough mother
column2: <name>. I think your talents are better suited elsewhere - like the root of the whole damn problem! <Razgor points to the west.> A thousand Scourge
column3: at least four full sized floating death machines and who knows what else. But you're gonna find out and then you're gonna handle it... That's right
column4: you're gonna beat the hell out of the Scourge army that's currently beating down our door. Get to the top of Warsong Hold and report to Wind Master To'bor. He'll be expecting you.

column1: Farseer Grimwalker's Spirit^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Spirit Talker Snarlfang^Farseer Grimwalker's Spirit^Farseer Grimwalker's Spirit^Vision of Air^^Speak with Farseer Grimwalker's Spirit inside of Magmoth.^You must go to Magmoth to the east. You must descend into the depths of their caverns. You must speak with Farseer Grimwalker's spirit!

Magic Carpet Ride^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Wind Master To'bor^Gorge the Corpsegrinder^The Defense of Warsong Hold^^^Talk to Yanni at Warsong Hold to arrange safe travel to the coast. Speak to Gorge the Corpsegrinder once you arrive at Garrosh's Landing.^Tanks
column2: mon. I be talkin' bout siege machines! We got heavy tanks stationed at Garrosh's Landing on da west coast. We gonna get you to da tank and you gonna use da tank to lay down some Horde justice on da Scourge! Da only tricky part be getting' you der. No way we be sendin' you on our wind riders. Too risky. You see dat pixie o'er der? Dat blondie elf? Yanni be his name
column3: mon. He can get you to da coast
column4: safely. Once der
column5: talk to Gorge da Corpsegrinder!

column1: Kaganishu^72^Horde^Borean Tundra^Farseer Grimwalker's Spirit^Farseer Grimwalker's Spirit^Farseer Grimwalker's Spirit^^^Retrieve Kaganishu's Fetish and use it upon Farseer Grimwalker's Remains.^After my small force of grunts were killed
column2: I was dragged down here and ritually murdered. The snobold who did this is known as Kaganishu. Though you have vanquished his shaman helpers
column3: my spirit is still tethered to this place. After he slew me
column4: he created a fetish from my body
column5: which anchors me here. Kaganishu is using it to learn all that I know of shamanism. You must retrieve the fetish from him and use it upon my spirit. Kaganishu is nearby in the caves. Only then will I truly be free.

column1: Return My Remains^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Farseer Grimwalker's Spirit^Spirit Talker Snarlfang^Farseer Grimwalker's Spirit^^^Deliver Farseer Grimwalker's Remains
column2: which are resting below his spirit
column3: to Spirit Talker Snarlfang at Bor'gorok Outpost.^<name>
column4: now that my spirit has been freed would you do me the honor of returning my remains to Spirit Talker Snarlfang? They lay upon the ground beneath me. I sense that the spirit talker is still at Bor'gorok Outpost to the west where last I saw her.

column1: Revenge Upon Magmoth^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Ortrosh^Ortrosh^^Vision of Air^^Kill 10 Magmoth Shaman
column2: 5 Magmoth Foragers
column3: 3 Magmoth Crushers
column4: and 3 Mates of Magmothregar. Then
column5: return to Ortrosh at Bor'gorok Outpost.^The overlord refuses to allow the shaman to heal my wounds. He says that it will be a good lesson for me and give me time to reflect upon my failure. But you could get revenge for me and the others who fell at Magmoth! I know that the spirit talker wants you to go in there to save the farseer. It's just to the east. Go
column6: <class>... go slay the magnataur and their snobold servants. Regain the outpost's honor!

column1: Words of Power^72^Horde^Borean Tundra^Chieftain Wintergale^Chieftain Wintergale^Shrouds of the Scourge^^Breaking Through^Bring High Priest Naferset's Scroll
column2: High Priest Talet-Kha's Scroll
column3: and High Priest Andorath's Scroll to Chieftain Wintergale at Taunka'le Village.^Within the spires you described dwell the main lieutenants of the Scourge leader
column4: the high priests. Not only do they command the Scourge forces
column5: but they hold the key to the necropolis above
column6: and their master. An endless stream of Scourge minions will overrun us if we can't find and defeat their leader. I cannot leave my people defenseless
column7: however much Durm might want to bring the fight to the enemy. It falls to you
column8: <name>
column9: to slay the high priests and take the scrolls they hold.

column1: A Courageous Strike^72^Horde^Borean Tundra^Durm Icehide^Durm Icehide^^Blending In^^Slay 15 En'kilah Ghouls and 5 En'kilah Necromancers and report back to Durm Icehide at Taunka'le Village.^From the beginning
column2: I've counseled that Chieftain Wintergale should assemble our mighty warriors and attack our enemy at their base. My advice has fallen on deaf ears and he has proven that he'd rather tip-toe around according to Sage Aeire's plans. I'll wait no longer. If Chieftain Wintergale is too cowardly to send our warriors into battle
column3: perhaps you'd be willing to show him that a direct attack can succeed. Storm the Temple City of En'kilah and slay all in your path
column4: <name>.

column1: Tank Ain't Gonna Fix Itself^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Gorge the Corpsegrinder^Mobu^The Defense of Warsong Hold^^Mobu's Pneumatic Tank Transjigamarig
column2: Super Strong Metal Plates!^Speak with Mobu at Garrosh's Landing.^We need to get these tanks back up and runnin'! They ain't gonna fix themselves. Mobu's gonna be the one to handle that stuff. Talk to him and see what he needs. Maybe you can shut him up before he finally drives me into a berserker frenzy and I cleave his little gnome-sized frame in two! I hate gnomes...

column1: Mobu's Pneumatic Tank Transjigamarig^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Mobu^Mobu^^Tank Ain't Gonna Fix Itself^Tanks a lot...^Mobu at the Coast of Echoes in the Borean Tundra wants you to recover his Pneumatic Tank Transjigamarig.^These wrenches are useless
column2: buddy. I need my pneumatic tank transjigamarig to get these things up and running! Unfortunately
column3: I left it at my old digs
column4: on the other side of this landing. It's the beat down hut next to the stables. You're gonna have to go and get it for me
column5: because I sure as hellfire am not going to go anywhere near the mist. Oh yea
column6: buddy
column7: watch out for the mist. The mist is what tore up these shores.

column1: Super Strong Metal Plates!^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Mobu^Mobu^^Tank Ain't Gonna Fix Itself^Tanks a lot...^Mobu at the Coast of Echoes in the Borean Tundra wants you to collect 10 Super Strong Metal Plates.^I need metal to patch these tanks up! Super strong metal plates can be found scattered about all across Garrosh's Landing and at the bottom of the bay. Just be careful when you're out there searching for plates. The mist is... um... AGGRESSIVE! The mist is what took out the landing and the adjoining tuskarr town. Poor little tuskarr...
Dirty
column2: Stinkin' Snobolds!^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Crafty Wobblesprocket^Crafty Wobblesprocket^Dirty
column3: Stinkin' Snobolds!^The Mechagnomes^^Retrieve 10 boxes of Crafty's Stuff and return them to Crafty Wobblesprocket at Fizzcrank Airstrip.^Those dirty
column4: stinkin' snobolds... they stole all of my supplies! What's a snobold you ask? It's like a kobold
column5: 'cept they serve the magnataur; kinda take care of them. I know
column6: weird! Anywho
column7: wanna help me out? I know the little creeps stole off with all of my stuff. Stupid me thinkin' that it'd be nice and safe
column8: packed up on the north side of the airstrip. Why don'tcha do me a favor and head north to their stupid Magmoth. There's a cash reward if you bring all my stuff back quick!

column1: The Borean Inquisition^71^All^Borean Tundra^Librarian Donathan^Librarian Normantis^Too Close For Comfort^^^Donathan ordered you to offer your assistance to Librarian Normantis in the mage tower on Amber Ledge.^Listen closely
column2: <name>
column3: for there is not a moment to spare. Your prisoner is being prepared for interrogation here in our tower. In the event that he is less than forthcoming
column4: your assistance may be required. Make your way up to where he is being detained and tell Librarian Normantis that I've sent you to assist him.

column1: Neutralizing the Cauldrons^72^Horde^Borean Tundra^Sage Aeire^Sage Aeire^^Blending In^^Sage Aeire at Taunka'le Village wants you to use her totem to neutralize the East Cauldron
column2: the Central Cauldron
column3: and the West Cauldron in the Temple City of En'kilah.^The presence of plague cauldrons within the Temple City of En'kilah worries me greatly
column4: <name>. It's clear that Chieftain Wintergale trusts your judgment and your knowledge of our enemy. Would you help me deal with the cauldrons as you help the chieftain carry out his plans in the Temple City? I've prepared a totem which will attack and neutralize the contents of the cauldrons. All you must do is locate the cauldrons and use the totem near each. Each Scourge weapon we destroy brings us closer to victory.

column1: The Art of Persuasion^71^All^Borean Tundra^Librarian Normantis^Librarian Normantis^Too Close For Comfort^^^Librarian Normantis on Amber Ledge wants you to use the Neural Needler on the Imprisoned Beryl Sorcerer until he reveals the location of Lady Evanor.^It is fortunate you're here
column2: <race>. You see
column3: the Kirin Tor code of conduct frowns upon our taking certain 'extreme' measures - even in desperate times such as these. You
column4: however
column5: as an outsider
column6: are not bound by such restrictions and could take any steps necessary in the retrieval of information. Do what you must. We need to know where Lady Evanor is being held at once! I'll just busy myself organizing these shelves here. Oh
column7: and here
column8: perhaps you'll find this old thing useful....

column1: Motes of the Enraged^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Imperean^Imperean^To Bor'gorok Outpost
column2: Quickly!^^^Obtain 5 Tempest Motes and deliver them to Imperean at the Ruins of Eldra'nath.^Now that their little squabble is dealt with
column3: there is still the matter of helping you and your spirit talker. As you can see
column4: my vassals have been enraged by the ongoing war between fire and water. This will not change anytime soon
column5: but it will serve to your advantage. In order to assist you
column6: what we need are their motes. Head further into the ruins and retrieve them from the tempests.

column1: Just a Few More Things...^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Crafty Wobblesprocket^Crafty Wobblesprocket^Dirty
column2: Stinkin' Snobolds!^^Hah... You're Not So Big Now!^Collect Crafty's Tools
column3: an Overcharged Capacitor
column4: and a Handful of Rocknar's Grit. Deliver them to Crafty Wobblesprocket at Fizzcrank Airstrip.^As you may have noticed
column5: we created the airstrip on the southern border of a magnataur den! <Crafty says something uncharitable about Fizzcrank under her breath.> The old man has put me in charge of finding a... ahem... creative solution to this situation: if we don't deal with them soon
column6: they'll come down here and tear us limb from limb! That's where you come in. I want you to get me everything on this shopping list. Please.

column1: Tanks a lot...^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Mobu^Gorge the Corpsegrinder^Tanks a lot...^Mobu's Pneumatic Tank Transjigamarig
column2: Super Strong Metal Plates!^^Speak to Gorge the Corpsegrinder at the Coast of Echoes.^Thanks for all your help
column3: buddy. You can let Gorge know the tanks are ready for action. Hopefully you can clean up this place once and for all!

column1: The Plains of Nasam^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Gorge the Corpsegrinder^Garrosh Hellscream^Tanks a lot...^^^Use the Horde Siege Tank to destroy 100 Scourge Soldiers and rescue 3 Injured Warsong Soldiers on the Plains of Nasam. You must also discover the identity of the leader of the Scourge assault.^Once you're ready
column2: jump into one of the tanks and drive it out to the Plains of Nasam
column3: southeast of here. Use the tank's weapon arsenal to take down the Scourge army. If you get in a jam
column4: the "Meatpounder" will tear 'em up and the land mines will finish 'em off! If you find any of our soldiers
column5: grab 'em! One last thing
column6: fuel tanks can be found all over the field. Try to get close enough to that structure in the center and see what's going on. If you do all of this and live
column7: go to Hellscream!

column1: Hah... You're Not So Big Now!^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Crafty Wobblesprocket^Crafty Wobblesprocket^Hah... You're Not So Big Now!^Just a Few More Things...^^Test out Crafty's Ultra-Advanced Proto-Typical Shortening Blaster on 5 Magmoth Crushers or Mates of Magmothregar. After you have done so
column2: return to her at Fizzcrank Airstrip.^That'll do her
column3: chief! So
column4: here's what I want ya to do.... Take my blaster and head north to Magmoth. If we're gonna have a chance at all against those monsters
column5: we need to cut them down to size... so to speak. In order to gauge its effectiveness
column6: I need you to slay the magnataur while the blaster's effects are still on it. Any of the crushers or mates will do
column7: but don't bother with the offspring... they're too small to worry about.

column1: The Spire of Blood^72^Horde^Borean Tundra^Vial of Fresh Blood^Snow Tracker Grumm^The Spire of Blood^^^Search the Spire of Blood for more information about the Vial of Fresh Blood.^As you inspect the captured blood vial
column2: you realize its contents are still warm. The victim must have just been bled and may still be alive. What use would the Scourge have for blood? They've never shown an interest in live prisoners in the past. Perhaps if you can locate the source of the blood
column3: you'll be able to discover what the Scourge is planning.

column1: Into the Mist^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Waltor of Pal'ea^Waltor of Pal'ea^Into the Mist^^^Waltor of Pal'ea at the Coast of Echoes in the Borean Tundra wants you to kill Kvaldir and recover 8 Tuskarr Relics.^Across the mist to the north you will find Garrosh's Landing. To the south are the ruins of my old home
column2: Pal'ea. Both have been ransacked by an ancient force known as the Kvaldir. These fearsome savages slew all of my people without mercy and drove your people inland. All that remains of the tuskarr of Pal'ea are our personal effects
column3: taken as relics by the Kvaldir. While we are not a vengeful race
column4: justice must be served. The tuskarr relics must be returned to me. Enter the mist and find them...

column1: Burn in Effigy^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Waltor of Pal'ea^Waltor of Pal'ea^Into the Mist^^Seek Out Karuk!^Waltor of Pal'ea at the Coast of Echoes in the Borean Tundra wants you to use the Tuskarr Torch to burn the Kvaldir ships at Pal'ea and Garrosh's Landing. You must destroy the following ships: The Serpent's Maw
column2: The Kur Drakkar
column3: Bor's Hammer and Bor's Anvil.^Tuskarr magic is similar to what your people call shamanism. While we serve the elements differently than you
column4: the power that we are able to call forth is formidable. <Waltor waves a torch-like baton in front of you.> With this tuskarr torch I want you to return to the mist and strike at the Kvaldir vessels. You will find three of their vessels docked behind the mist at Garrosh's Landing
column5: north of here
column6: and one docked off the shores of Pal'ea
column7: to the south. Burn their ships in effigy! For all to see!

column1: Plan B^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Crafty Wobblesprocket^Crafty Wobblesprocket^Hah... You're Not So Big Now!^^It Was The Orcs
column2: Honest!^Collect 10 Warsong Outfits and a Warsong Banner. Bring them back to Crafty Wobblesprocket at Fizzcrank Airstrip.^Okay
column3: don't panic! The blaster might not've worked
column4: but we still have options. <Crafty snaps her fingers.> We're going to divert attention away from the airstrip! To make this work
column5: we'll need a few things first. <Wobblesprocket looks you up and down appraisingly.> Steeljaw's caravan
column6: just to the west
column7: stupidly took a shortcut through a taunka graveyard and was destroyed by their risen spirits. Head over there and get some outfits off of the dead orcs. Pick up one of their banners
column8: too!

column1: Shatter the Orbs!^72^Horde^Borean Tundra^Snow Tracker Grumm^Snow Tracker Junek^The Spire of Blood^^^Destroy 5 Blood Globes and report to Snow Tracker Junek at Taunka'le Village.^They're... bleeding the prisoners... putting the blood... in those globes. <Grumm's eyes close momentarily and he leans his head back.> The blood... taken up to necropolis... to feed blood prince... <Grumm gasps for breath.> P-promise... you'll... destroy blood... globes... bring word... to Junek. <The snow tracker collapses into unconsciousness.>

Horn of the Ancient Mariner^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Waltor of Pal'ea^Waltor of Pal'ea^Horn of the Ancient Mariner^^^Waltor of Pal'ea at the Coast of Echoes in the Borean Tundra wants you to bring him the Horn of the Ancient Mariner.^A Kvaldir lieutenant known as Orabus directed the initial incursion against my people at Pal'ea
column2: He oversaw the destruction of both villages and then disappeared into the mist. In those early days there was talk of a horn that Orabus gifted to the Kvaldir mistweavers. This horn could be used to summon him should the need arise. We need to get that horn from the Kvaldir mistweavers and call forth Orabus. If he is destroyed
column3: these savages might retreat. Seek out mistweavers at Pal'ea
column4: to the south.

column1: Orabus the Helmsman^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Waltor of Pal'ea^Waltor of Pal'ea^Horn of the Ancient Mariner^^^Waltor of Pal'ea at the Coast of Echoes in the Borean Tundra wants you to use the Horn of the Ancient Mariner to summon Orabus the Helmsman. Once summoned
column2: slay Orabus the Helmsman.^Take the horn and travel west to the Warsong Jetty. Make your way to the end of the jetty and blow into the horn. The sound should rouse Orabus. Slay the foul beast and return to me!

column1: Seek Out Karuk!^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Waltor of Pal'ea^Karuk^^Burn in Effigy^^Seek out Karuk at Riplash Strand.^A fellow survivor of Pal'ea known as Karuk has made his way to the main base of the Kvaldir in the Borean Tundra - far to the south where the snow was once bountiful. Karuk hides along the bluffs overlooking Riplash Strand. Seek out Karuk and let him know what you did for my people here at the Coast of Echoes. The safest route to Karuk is through your fortress. From Warsong Hold
column2: take the road south and follow it around until you reach Riplash Strand.

column1: Sharing Intelligence^71^All^Borean Tundra^Librarian Normantis^Librarian Donathan^Too Close For Comfort^^^Normantis has asked you to report to Librarian Donathan on Amber Ledge.^Thank you
column2: <class>! The information you've extracted is of vital importance to the Kirin Tor. Return at once to Donathan as we make plans for the rescue of Lady Evanor.

column1: Escaping the Mist^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Mootoo the Younger^Elder Mootoo^^^^Follow Mootoo the Younger out of the mist. Speak to Elder Mootoo should you successfully save Mootoo the Younger.^I can hear the mist creatures outside. Their yells are driving me mad
column2: but I dare not try to escape. And where would I even go? How long would it be until they caught up with me and executed me like the others? I wonder
column3: how far has the mist crept
column4: stranger? Has it overtaken this whole continent? Would you be willing to help me try and escape the mist? I think I can lead us back toward my father. I still sense his life spirit. He is close.

column1: Crocolisks in the City^70^All^Fishing^Old Man Barlo^Old Man Barlo^^^^Bring a Baby Crocolisk to Old Man Barlo. You can find him fishing northeast of Shattrath City by Silmyr Lake.^Hello <lad/lass>. I'm glad you've stopped by to talk to this old man--there's trouble back home. A traveling merchant recently sold a batch of baby crocolisks to some gullible children. Crocolisks are wild beasts
column2: and many have escaped and now lurk in city waterways. Grab your strongest fishing pole and drop a line in Stormwind or Orgrimmar and bring one of the little devils back to me. I'm anxious to see one.

column1: Bait Bandits^70^All^Fishing^Old Man Barlo^Old Man Barlo^^^^Bring a Blackfin Darter to Old Man Barlo. You can find him fishing northeast of Shattrath City by Silmyr Lake.^You probably know all about the golden darter--they're fairly common in the rivers of Terokkar Forest and a delicacy for priests. But here's one you haven't heard of: the blackfin darter. The fish is notoriously crafty and difficult to catch. You have to pull your line at the last possible second
column2: because they nibble at the bait before they take it. Drop your line in the rivers of Terokkar and bring me a blackfin darter. Avoid the lakes
column3: as the blackfin only thrive in moving water.

column1: The One That Got Away^70^All^Fishing^Old Man Barlo^Old Man Barlo^^^^Catch the World's Largest Mudfish and bring it to Old Man Barlo. You can find him fishing northeast of Shattrath City by Silmyr Lake.^Figluster's mudfish is a surprisingly quick bottom feeder found in the waters of Nagrand. They grow their entire lives and are well known as fighters. Years ago
column2: I caught what I'm certain was the world's biggest mudfish... until it snapped my line and escaped. A fisherman of your caliber doesn't need to be told what to do--your destiny awaits in the lakes of Nagrand.

column1: Shrimpin' Ain't Easy^70^All^Fishing^Old Man Barlo^Old Man Barlo^^^^Bring 10 Giant Freshwater Shrimp to Old Man Barlo. You can find him fishing northeast of Shattrath City by Silmyr Lake.^There's a lot of big fish in the Zangarmarsh lakes. Ever wonder what they eat? Shrimp. Giant freshwater shrimp. The Rokk tells me the dishes you can make with shrimp are nearly endless. But shrimp are too small to catch with a fishing line. So here's the trick: cut open the bloated barbed gill trout and you'll find a shrimp or two if you're lucky.

Felblood Fillet^70^All^Fishing^Old Man Barlo^Old Man Barlo^^^^Bring a Monstrous Felblood Snapper to Old Man Barlo. You can find him fishing northeast of Shattrath City by Silmyr Lake.^This old man is going hunting soon. I'm gonna take down a mammoth shark off the coast of Azshara. The thing is
column2: I need a toxin that'll stay on a spear tip while it's underwater. To make that kind of stuff
column3: I need the glands from a poisonous fish: the felblood snapper. Such a vile fish only thrives in the waters of Hellfire Peninsula and Shadowmoon Valley. Bring me back a whopper and I'll be a happy old man.

column1: It Was The Orcs
column2: Honest!^72^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Crafty Wobblesprocket^Crafty Wobblesprocket^^Plan B^^While disguised as a Warsong orc
column3: plant the Warsong Banner in the corpse of Magmothregar. Then
column4: return with the disguise to Crafty Wobblesprocket at Fizzcrank Airstrip.^With all of those outfits you
column5: er
column6: recovered
column7: I fashioned a Warsong orc disguise. I had the genius idea of combining it with some old stuff that I had left hanging around from last Hallows' End
column8: so it should be foolproof! Here
column9: in this sack is the disguise and the banner you recovered. Head down into the bowels of Magmoth and slay the magnataur chieftain
column10: Magmothregar. If you're going to convince them to turn their attention on the Warsong orcs
column11: you'll need to plant the banner while disguised.

column1: A Race Against Time^71^All^Borean Tundra^Librarian Donathan^Librarian Donathan^Too Close For Comfort^^^Donathan on Amber Ledge has tasked you with using the Beryl Shield Detonator to bring down the shield at Beryl Point. You are then to defeat Salrand and collect the key she holds.^So it's true. They have her. It's clear what must be done
column2: <race>. She WILL be saved. I must remain here and aid in the rescue preparations. I call upon you again; this time to collect the prison key. All we know of this Salrand figure is that she cannot be harmed so long as her shield is intact. We've customized a special explosive that should strip her of this protection
column3: allowing you to perform your duty. Return to me when you've collected the key. Hurry
column4: <name>. Lady Evanor is suffering!

column1: Enlistment Day^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Recruitment Officer Blythe^General Arlos^^^A Time for Heroes^Meet with General Arlos inside the barracks in Valiance Keep.^You've come to enlist
column2: right? Normally you'd have to stand in line like the other recruits. Normally you'd be out of luck because the recruitment ledger's gone missing and I can't process anyone until the new books get here. Fortunately for you
column3: <name>
column4: I've heard about you and what you did in Outland. To be honest
column5: you're a cut above these poor saps. Lines aren't for you. Go to the barracks and speak to General Arlos. He'll be more than happy to meet with someone of your caliber.

column1: Get Me Outa Here!^72^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Bonker Togglevolt^Fizzcrank Fullthrottle^^^^Escort Bonker Togglevolt to safety and then report in with Fizzcrank Fullthrottle at Fizzcrank Airstrip.^I knew they'd send someone for me sooner or later... turned out to be later
column2: of course. I came in here to parlay with the snobolds
column3: but their main shaman
column4: Kaganishu
column5: decided instead that I'd make a tasty snack for Magmothregar. Wait... what?! They didn't send you?! DID THEY FORGET ABOUT ME?! Okay
column6: you're here now and that's all that matters. As soon as you break this chain we'll make our way back to the airstrip. Then you can tell Fizzcrank I'm safely back. If he remembers me
column7: that is.

column1: Sage Highmesa is Missing^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Greatmother Taiga^Sage Highmesa^Sage Highmesa is Missing^^^Find Sage Highmesa near the Dens of Dying.^There are many new mysteries walking the lands now. One of our sages
column2: Highmesa
column3: has foolishly gone north with only one longrunner to investigate something strange near the Dens of Dying. What are the dens
column4: you ask? They are a sacred place to the magnataur
column5: where they go in their old age to die. She saw something fall from the sky near them a few days ago. If you would be friend to the taunka
column6: I would have you find and help her. She is not so stubborn that she will not accept your aid.

column1: A Proper Death^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Sage Highmesa^Sage Highmesa^Sage Highmesa is Missing^^^Destroy 10 Plagued Magnataur and then return to Sage Highmesa south of The Dens of Dying.^The magnataur at the Dens of Dying have contracted a plague. We must find the cause
column2: but first we must put them out of their misery. <race>
column3: you must go north onto the slopes in front of us and destroy as many of the poor creatures as you can.

column1: Merciful Freedom^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Shadowstalker Canarius^Shadowstalker Canarius^^Reinforcements Incoming...^^Shadowstalker Canarius at Warsong Farms Outpost wants you to free 5 Scourge Prisoners.^The soldiers that they didn't kill are being held in cages scattered across this farmland. Through some thievery we've managed to find a few keys
column2: but we're unable to get close enough to any prisoners without being attacked. We need your "talents" in securing those keys and freeing the prisoners. Bash in the brains of the necrolords and aberrations and take their keys. Use those keys to free Scourge prisoners.

column1: Stop the Plague^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Sage Highmesa^Sage Highmesa^Sage Highmesa is Missing^^Find Bristlehorn
column2: Fallen Necropolis^Sage Highmesa
column3: standing just south of The Dens of Dying
column4: has asked you to use Highmesa's Cleansing Seeds at a Den of Dying Plague Cauldron to neutralize it.^I'm convinced that the plague is being caused by something in the caves up there. <class>
column5: I want you to take these seeds. I normally use them as a ward against the Scourge
column6: though perhaps they can be used to disrupt whatever foulness is happening in the dens. Find the source of the plague and throw them into it.

column1: Find Bristlehorn^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Sage Highmesa^Longrunner Bristlehorn^Find Bristlehorn^Stop the Plague^^Find Longrunner Bristlehorn at Talramas.^Bristlehorn should have returned by now. The other reason why we came up here was to investigate that Scourge structure to the west
column2: which fell from the sky. He's impetuous and has likely gotten himself into trouble. <name>
column3: go to that place and find him
column4: please.

column1: Reforging the Key^71^All^Borean Tundra^Librarian Donathan^Surristrasz^Too Close For Comfort^^Taking Wing^Donathan wants you to speak to Surristrasz on Amber Ledge.^Delays
column2: delays... the one thing we cannot afford right now! As much as I hate to disturb Lord Surristrasz
column3: he's our only hope of saving our beloved Evanor. Bring him the key fragments and hope that his mood is favorable. Hurry
column4: <class>
column5: our assault team is waiting.

column1: Taking Wing^71^All^Borean Tundra^Surristrasz^Warmage Anzim^Taking Wing^Reforging the Key^^Give Salrand's Key to Warmage Anzim when you are ready to free Evanor.^The key is forged anew. Now heed my counsel
column2: <race>. Succeed in your endeavor or die trying
column3: for if a single scale falls from one of my drakes I shall hold you personally accountable. Now
column4: off with you.

column1: Rescuing Evanor^71^All^Borean Tundra^Warmage Anzim^Archmage Evanor^Taking Wing^^^Anzim on Amber Ledge wants you to fly with his war mages to free Lady Evanor at Beryl Point. You are then to report to her in the mage tower on Amber Ledge.^At last
column2: we attack! Once we've cleared the platform I'll use the key. You are to ensure that Lady Evanor remains safe after her release. Hurry now
column3: let us be off!

column1: Dragonspeak^71^All^Borean Tundra^Archmage Evanor^Surristrasz^Taking Wing^^^Lady Evanor has sent you to speak with Surristrasz on Amber Ledge.^I am aware of your recent deeds here
column2: <name>
column3: and again I thank you. As for this local menace
column4: we've learned all we need to know from them. They'll be dealt with in short order. On now to more important issues.... Azeroth needs you. The region just west of here is the center of an urgent crisis. I'll leave the details to Lord Surristrasz. You must speak with him at once. Good luck
column5: friend of Dalaran.

column1: Fallen Necropolis^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Sage Highmesa^Sage Highmesa^^Stop the Plague^^Destroy 20 Scourge of any type at Talramas and the Festering Pools. Then
column2: return to Sage Highmesa just to the south of The Dens of the Dying.^The fallen necropolis to the west can only be assumed to still be filled with Scourge. While you are at Talramas
column3: <class>
column4: I would ask that you dispatch all of the Lich King's servants that you find within and in the surrounding pools where it fell.

column1: Scouting the Sinkholes^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Greatfather Mahan^Greatfather Mahan^Scouting the Sinkholes^^^Greatfather Mahan at Taunka'le Village wants you to use the Map of the Geyser Fields to mark the locations of the South Sinkhole
column2: the Northwest Sinkhole
column3: and the Northeast Sinkhole.^Can you feel the tremors in the earth? The Scourge's nerubians are on the move deep beneath the ground. They've emerged to the southwest in the Geyser Fields
column4: and are harassing the patrols Chieftain Wintergale sent out. <The taunka elder offers you a worn map.> Perhaps a single person can succeed where the patrols have failed. Take this with you to the Geyser Fields and map out the locations of the Nerubian sinkholes.

column1: The Heart of the Elements^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Greatfather Mahan^Wind Tamer Barah^Scouting the Sinkholes^^^Bring 5 Elemental Hearts to Wind Tamer Barah at Taunka'le Village.^Now that we know the exact locations of the nerubian sinkholes
column2: we can collapse them to halt the Scourge offensive and cripple their force. Wind Tamer Barah knows a way to harness elementals to destroy the tunnels the Nerubians are using
column3: but she will require your help. Southeast of the village
column4: near the coast beyond the Frozen Reach
column5: you'll find an area dominated by frozen earth elementals. The hearts of these elements are exactly what Wind Tamer Barah will need.

column1: The Warsong Farms^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Shadowstalker Ickoris^Shadowstalker Ickoris^Untold Truths^^^Shadowstalker Ickoris at Warsong Farms Outpost wants you to scout Warsong Granary
column2: Torp's Farm
column3: and Warsong Slaughterhouse.^According to Luther's notes the Scourge is now using this place as a breeding ground for those monsters you see lumbering across the field. <Ickoris shudders.> Those monsters were once orcs... tauren... We need more information before a plan can be devised. I want you to investigate three sites that are heavily trafficked by Scourge: the Warsong Granary
column4: southwest of us
column5: Torp's Farm
column6: directly west of us
column7: and the old Warsong Slaughterhouse
column8: north of us. Return to me once you've scouted 'em out.

column1: The Doctor and the Lich-Lord^72^Horde^Borean Tundra^Longrunner Bristlehorn^Sage Highmesa^Find Bristlehorn^^^Destroy Doctor Razorgrin and Lich-Lord Chillwinter. Then
column2: return to Sage Highmesa just to the south of The Dens of Dying.^There are two... that must... be killed. The doctor and... the lich-lord... are above. Find them... destroy them... before.... ...it is too... late....

column1: Damned Filthy Swine^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Farmer Torp^Farmer Torp^Damned Filthy Swine^Reinforcements Incoming...^^Farmer Torp at Warsong Farms Outpost wants you to kill 10 Unliving Swine.^Just look at 'em! My beautiful kodos are helpless to defend themselves against those filthy swine! I need you to buy me some time
column2: <race>. I think I can cure the kodo of the sickness
column3: but you need to keep the unliving swine off 'em
column4: else there'll be nothin' left to cure! Get out there and send those swine to their graves - permanently!

column1: Return with the Bad News^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Sage Highmesa^Greatmother Taiga^Find Bristlehorn^^^Speak with Greatmother Taiga at Taunka'le Village.^The greatmother will need to know
column2: <name>. Will you please return to Taunka'le? Tell her that I will be following shortly.

column1: Bring 'Em Back Alive^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Farmer Torp^Farmer Torp^Damned Filthy Swine^^^Farmer Torp at Warsong Farms Outpost wants you to rescue 8 Infected Kodo Beasts.^Take this riding snaffle
column2: <name>. You'll notice that I've placed a tiny medicine dispenser in the mouthpiece. That thing will cure the infection as soon as a kodo bites down. Once you've cured the sick out of 'em
column3: you'll need to ride 'em home. They'll be weak so you'll need to gently direct 'em here. Bring my babies back
column4: <name>! One last thing
column5: you've got ten minutes! That's how long the antidote will remain effective inside that snaffle.

column1: Check in With Bixie^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Mordle Cogspinner^Bixie Wrenchshanker^What's the Matter with the Transmatter?^^^Mordle Cogspinner has asked you to find Bixie Wrenchshanker to the south of The Dens of Dying.^You're a proven <hero /heroine>. I have another problem! My boss
column2: Tinky
column3: went east with Bixie Wrenchshanker and I CAN'T get the outgoing on this thing to work! Tinky's the only one that can fix it and we really need it working one-hundred percent. You think you could find them? Bixie said something about following some old magnataur to a place called The Dens of Dying. I'm guessing that's where you'll find them. You can catch a ride out there by talking with Kara Thricestar at the runway.

column1: Oh Great... Plagued Magnataur!^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Bixie Wrenchshanker^Bixie Wrenchshanker^What's the Matter with the Transmatter?^^^Kill 10 Plagued Magnataur and then return to Bixie Wrenchshanker to the south of The Dens of Dying.^Tinky and I came out here stalking some old magnataur. Apparently those caves up there are where they go to die. Of course
column2: we had no idea that they were going to get plagued when they went in there. We can't have plagued things just roaming about; it's not healthy. Say
column3: why don't you put down a number of those things while I figure out what our next step should be?

column1: There's Something Going On In Those Caves^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Bixie Wrenchshanker^Bixie Wrenchshanker^What's the Matter with the Transmatter?^^Rats
column2: Tinky Went into the Necropolis!
column3: Might As Well Wipe Out the Scourge^Bixie Wrenchshanker
column4: skulking just to the south of The Dens of Dying
column5: has asked you to use Bixie's Inhibiting Powder at a Den of Dying Plague Cauldron to neutralize it.^So
column6: while you were out taking care of those plagued beasts
column7: I took a peek inside the caves up there. There are cultists in there plaguing them! They have some sort of noxious concoction brewing in a cauldron. I have a powder that I normally use as an anti-poison
column8: and I mixed it up with some other stuff. I think it'll neutralize their brew! Take it up to one of those caves and see if it works.

column1: The Horn of Elemental Fury^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Wind Tamer Barah^Wind Tamer Barah^Scouting the Sinkholes^^^Reclaim the Lower Horn Half and Upper Horn Half from Chieftain Burblegoggle and Chieftain Gurgleboggle and bring them to Wind Tamer Barah at Taunka'le Village.^I can fashion the likeness of an elemental from these pieces of inanimate stone
column2: but breathing life into it is different. For that
column3: we'll need help and a bit of luck. Legend tells of an ancient artifact called the Horn of Elemental Fury
column4: sought after by a great hero. I'll lend you a scroll with a copy of the tale. I don't know if the legend is true
column5: but it's our best bet. If the legend is right
column6: the parts of the horn may be in the Flood Plains surrounding the village to the north and southwest.

column1: Rats
column2: Tinky Went into the Necropolis!^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Bixie Wrenchshanker^Tinky Wickwhistle^Rats
column3: Tinky Went into the Necropolis!^There's Something Going On In Those Cave^^Find Tinky Wickwhistle inside Talramas.^I told Tinky not to go off on her own
column4: but she just HAD to check out that crashed necropolis to the west. I'm 100% certain that those cultists came from inside that thing
column5: which means I'm now 100% certain that Tinky's in trouble! She's the airstrip's number one engineer. Without her we're doomed! I'd find her myself
column6: but one of those things got in a swipe on my leg before I could vanish again. <name>
column7: if anyone can get her out
column8: it's you!

column1: Might As Well Wipe Out the Scourge^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Bixie Wrenchshanker^Bixie Wrenchshanker^^There's Something Going On In Those Cave^^Destroy 20 Scourge of any type at Talramas and the Festering Pools. Then
column2: return to Bixie Wrenchshanker just to the south of The Dens of the Dying.^If the cultists up in those caves survived the crash
column3: then that fallen necropolis to the west can only be assumed to still be filled with Scourge. There're probably lots of them out in front of it in the pools
column4: too! While you're at Talramas
column5: <class>
column6: do you think you could dispatch all of the Lich King's flunkies that you find there?

column1: I'm Stuck in this Damned Cage... But Not For Long!^72^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Tinky Wickwhistle^Tinky Wickwhistle^Rats
column2: Tinky Went into the Necropolis!^^Let Bixie Know^Collect an Engine-Core Crystal
column3: a Magical Gyroscope
column4: and a Piloting Scourgestone. Deliver them to Tinky Wickwhistle at Talramas.^The cultists magicked me into this cage and there's no door to it. Little did they know that I'm the chief transmatter engineer for the airstrip! With your help
column5: and a little elbow-grease
column6: I won't be in here for long. I'm going to need an engine-core crystal from one of the ghouls in here
column7: a magical gyroscope from their doctor
column8: and a piloting scourgestone from the lich-lord up top. With all of that stuff
column9: I should be able to make a port device to get back to Fizzcrank's and escape the gnome way!

column1: Let Bixie Know^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Tinky Wickwhistle^Bixie Wrenchshanker^^I'm Stuck in this Damned Cage... But Not^Back to the Airstrip^Speak with Bixie Wrenchshanker just south of The Dens of Dying.^My evil twin's out there somewhere now. I'm pretty sure that she's not back at the airstrip. In fact
column2: wherever she ended up
column3: it's colder there than here. But I could only 'feel' her for a moment. Oh well
column4: I'll reconfigure this thing and port myself back to the airstrip soon enough. In the meantime
column5: do you think you could go east and let Bixie know that I'll meet her back there? Thanks
column6: <name>!

column1: Back to the Airstrip^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Bixie Wrenchshanker^Fizzcrank Fullthrottle^^Let Bixie Know^^Speak with Fizzcrank Fullthrottle at Fizzcrank Airstrip in Borean Tundra.^Okay
column2: I think I'm going to start making my way back to the airstrip
column3: too. Of course
column4: I'm moving a little slower with this leg injury. Say
column5: do you think you could get there ahead of me and pass on the good news to Ol' Fizzcrank? I bet anything that there'll be a reward in it for you. Thanks
column6: <name>!

column1: King Mrgl-Mrgl^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Supply Master Taz'ishi^King Mrgl-Mrgl^King Mrgl-Mrgl^^^Speak with King Mrgl-Mrgl at Winterfin Retreat.^Dis is gonna sound weird
column2: <class>
column3: but dere be a murloc askin' for our help! He goes by da name of King Mrgl-Mrgl
column4: leader of da Winterfin murlocs. Him and his people been run outa dere village and wantin' you to come save dem. You find him by headin' west and go down da cliffs. He hangin' out on da south side of da Winterfin Retreat.

column1: Get to Getry^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Shadowstalker Ickoris^Shadowstalker Getry^Untold Truths^^Foolish Endeavors^Find Shadowstalker Getry at Warsong Farms.^The Scourge agent that's overseeing the abduction and transformation of Horde soldiers into undead monsters is using the northwest farm as a spawning glade. Shadowstalker Getry has been staking out that monster for the past week and has gathered some vital information that might allow us to end this menace. Get to Getry and see if you can help him put a stop to this Scourge assembly line. You'll find Getry at the abandoned tower on the northwest border of these farms.
King Mrgl-Mrgl^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Mordle Cogspinner^King Mrgl-Mrgl^King Mrgl-Mrgl^^^Speak with King Mrgl-Mrgl at Winterfin Retreat.^This is the weirdest thing
column2: <class>
column3: but there's a murloc asking for our help! He goes by the name of King Mrgl-Mrgl
column4: leader of the Winterfin murlocs. It would seem that he and his people have been run out of their village and they want someone to come save them. That someone is you! You'll find Winterfin Retreat
column5: and the king
column6: by heading west down the road until you come to the cliffs. Head down to the water line near the Blistering Pool.

column1: Foolish Endeavors^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Shadowstalker Getry^Garrosh Hellscream^Foolish Endeavors^Get to Getry^Nork Bloodfrenzy's Charge^Help Getry defeat Varidus the Flenser at Warsong Farms.^This is madness. How do they expect us to take on a Scourge necrolord and an unknown number of his minions? <Getry sighs.> If Ickoris sent you he must think that you are capable of great feats. Perhaps you will call down a miracle today
column2: eh? When you're ready we will descend and face Varidus. If we make it out of this mess in one piece
column3: report back to Hellscream in Warsong Hold.

column1: The Collapse^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Wind Tamer Barah^Wind Tamer Barah^Scouting the Sinkholes^^^Wind Tamer Barah at Taunka'le Village wants you to collapse the Nerubian sinkholes using the Horn of Elemental Fury and defeat Lord Kryxix.^I have created and bound Alluvius using the Horn of Elemental Fury. He will respond to the horn's call when you stand near the southernmost sinkhole in the Geyser Fields. The quake Alluvius will unleash should collapse the Nerubian tunnels and put an end to their flanking attack. I wouldn't be surprised if the Nerubian commander showed himself after the quake. If the collapse of the tunnels doesn't break the back of their assault
column2: the defeat of their leader surely will.

column1: Distress Call^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Airman Skyhopper^Fizzcrank Fullthrottle^Distress Call^Plug the Sinkholes^^Speak with Fizzcrank Fullthrottle at Fizzcrank Airstrip.^Oh good
column2: you're <name>
column3: right? We need your help up north at Fizzcrank Airstrip
column4: like yesterday! The magnataur
column5: and the Scourge... and the pumping station! It's madness I tell you
column6: madness! You've got to head up there and talk to old man Fullthrottle a.s.a.p.!

column1: The Mechagnomes^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Fizzcrank Fullthrottle^Jinky Wingnut^Distress Call^^Dirty
column2: Stinkin' Snobolds!
column3: What's the Matter with the Transmatter?^Listen to Fizzcrank Fullthrottle's tale and then find Jinky Wingnut at Fizzcrank Airstrip.^Now that you're here
column4: it's time for me to tell you the full story of what's going on. After you've heard my tale
column5: go outside and find my second-in-command
column6: Jinky Wingnut. She'll handle everything from here on out.

column1: Nork Bloodfrenzy's Charge^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Garrosh Hellscream^Warden Nork Bloodfrenzy^Foolish Endeavors^^^Speak to Warden Nork Bloodfrenzy at Warsong Hold in Borean Tundra.^While you have done much to secure our foothold in these frozen wastes
column2: other dangers still lurk in the shadows. I want you to assist Warden Nork Bloodfrenzy
column3: stationed at the internment camp just outside and immediately southeast of Warsong Hold. Seek him out and offer your assistance for prisoner transport and exchange. You are dismissed
column4: <name>.

column1: What's the Matter with the Transmatter?^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Mordle Cogspinner^Mordle Cogspinner^What's the Matter with the Transmatter?^The Mechagnomes^^Collect 15 Fizzcrank Spare Parts and deliver them to Mordle Cogspinner at Fizzcrank Airstrip.^There're spare parts strewn all over to the east in the Scalding Pools
column2: the Geyser Fields... heck
column3: probably even up on the pumping station still
column4: too. Bring back a whole bunch. Maybe then I'll be able to get outgoing teleport on this thing working
column5: not to mention getting the incoming transmatter ports aligned. I'd hate to see another accident....

column1: Coward Delivery... Under 30 Minutes or it's Free^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Warden Nork Bloodfrenzy^Scout Tungok^Foolish Endeavors^^^Take the Alliance Deserter to the crossroads east of Warsong Hold and fire your Warsong Flare Gun to signal the Alliance.^We're seeing more deserters show up at our gates with each passing day. We simply do not have enough room to keep all of these maggots caged up. Especially not if we want to keep the pigs happy. <Nork snorts as he laughs.> I want you to escort one of these cowards to the crossroads east of here and fire this flare gun. One of their captains will show up when they see the flare and take the coward off your hands. Report to Scout Tungok on the east road once the delivery has been made.

Re-Cursive^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Jinky Wingnut^Jinky Wingnut^Distress Call^^Finding Pilot Tailspin^Jinky Wingnut at Fizzcrank Airstrip has asked you to use the Re-Cursive Transmatter Injection on 6 Fizzcrank Mechagnomes.^If you listened to the old man
column2: then you know that we have gnomes out there that were changed. Gearmaster Mechazod infected them with something that reversed the "Curse of the Flesh"
column3: and now they're robots! We think we have a way to re-curse them back to normal. We want you to take this re-cursive transmatter injection and use it on the corpses of any mechagnomes you come across. We're hoping that this stuff will cure them and allow us to lock onto them to port 'em out of there. Whaddya say
column4: <name>?

column1: Scouting the Sinkholes^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Abner Fizzletorque^Abner Fizzletorque^Scouting the Sinkholes^Give Fizzcrank the News^^Abner Fizzletorque at Fizzcrank Airstrip wants you to use the Map of the Geyser Fields to mark the locations of the South Sinkhole
column2: the Northwest Sinkhole
column3: and the Northeast Sinkhole.^Fizzcrank sent out an aerial surveillance team to map the Nerubian sinkholes in the southern part of the Geyser Fields
column4: but they haven't yet returned. I can't afford to wait any longer for their information
column5: so I'm going to need someone to check out the sinkholes on foot. I understand the dangers involved
column6: and I'll compensate you accordingly. Take this map with you and record the vital information about each of the sinkholes you encounter out there.

column1: Vermin Extermination^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Scout Tungok^Scout Tungok^Foolish Endeavors^^^Scout Tungok at the Bloodspore Plains in the Borean Tundra wants you to kill 8 Bloodspore Harvesters
column2: 5 Bloodspore Firestarters and 2 Bloodspore Roasters.^Perhaps you'd be interested in helping me clean up these fields? They're littered with dirty little rat men! Kobolds
column3: snobolds
column4: whatever you wanna call 'em
column5: they're all over the damned place. The stink alone is making my life hell! Take care of the vermin for me and I'll make it worth your while
column6: <name>.

column1: Fueling the Project^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Abner Fizzletorque^Abner Fizzletorque^Scouting the Sinkholes^^^Abner Fizzletorque at Fizzcrank Airstrip wants you to collect 8 Barrels of Oil using the Portable Oil Collector.^I plan to build a machine that will collapse the tunnels the Scourge is using to deploy their Nerubians
column2: but with the main drilling rig out of order
column3: we'll have to collect the fuel for the device some other way. Out in the Geyser Fields to the southeast
column4: small pools of oil bubble up away from the main rig. If you can collect enough of the oil from those pools
column5: I can make a crude fuel to power the machine. Simply deploy the collector near the rig
column6: and it will pump and store the oil in its tank.

column1: The Wondrous Bloodspore^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Bloodmage Laurith^Bloodmage Laurith^The Wondrous Bloodspore^^^Bloodmage Laurith at the Bloodspore Plains in the Borean Tundra wants you to recover 10 Bloodspore Carpels.^We are witnessing something amazing here
column2: <race>. A whole undiscovered ecology lives and breathes not more than a few paces from us! I surmise it is the bloodspore plant that sets this environment abuzz. I have collected some pollen from the nearby male species of bloodspore plant but still lack female receptors for pollination. Fetch me a bushel of the bloodspore carpels. You'll find them near the larger plants surrounding us. Be wary of their guardians! The kobolds won't give them up easily!

column1: Pollen from the Source^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Bloodmage Laurith^Bloodmage Laurith^The Wondrous Bloodspore^^^Bloodmage Laurith at the Bloodspore Plains in the Borean Tundra wants you to recover 5 Bloodspore Moth Pollen.^It's obvious! The bloodspore moths are the entities responsible for pollination on these plains. It must be something that happens within the moth's internal system that acts as a catalyst for this pollen to work. It's all starting to make sense now
column2: <name>. That's why the kobolds don't kill the moths and instead go to great lengths to protect them! Those stupid little rats have it all figured out! Well we'll just have to get our own moth pollen! What do you say? Fetch me some in the name of science?

column1: A Bot in Mammoth's Clothing^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Abner Fizzletorque^Abner Fizzletorque^Scouting the Sinkholes^^^Abner Fizzletorque at Fizzcrank Airstrip wants you to bring him 6 Thick Mammoth Hides.^I've reconfigured the skeleton of an old bot to create an earthquake large enough to collapse the tunnels
column2: but the machinery is delicate and sensitive to Northrend's biting cold. I've devised a means of insulating it using the thickest hides of the native mammoths. They roam the plains south of the airstrip and adjacent to the Geyser Fields. Bring back enough of the hides for me to finish the machine and then we'll be able to unleash it on the Nerubians!

column1: A Suitable Test Subject^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Bloodmage Laurith^Bloodmage Laurith^The Wondrous Bloodspore^^^Bloodmage Laurith at the Bloodspore Plains in the Borean Tundra has asked that you use the Pollinated Bloodspore Flower and allow her to observe the results.^<Laurith looks you over as if to size you up.> So we've got this pollinated bloodspore flower and nobody to test its effects on. Say
column2: would you perhaps be interested in rubbing this on your skin and letting me observe? What's the worst that could happen anyway? Don't you worry
column3: <name>! Just take this sample and rub it all over your face.

column1: The Invasion of Gammoth^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Bloodmage Laurith^Primal Mighthorn^The Wondrous Bloodspore^^^Speak to Primal Mighthorn at the Bloodspore Plains in the Borean Tundra.^Hellscream assigned Mighthorn and I with the daunting task of magnataur extermination on the southern front of Warsong Hold. With us came an entire platoon of seasoned Horde soldiers. Our initial foray into the nearby magnataur dens proved quite unsuccessful as our entire squad was wiped out by the lair defenders. We're the only ones left... We aren't scientists or researchers. We're soldiers of the Horde
column2: just like you. Soldiers on a mission that cannot fail... Speak to Primal Mighthorn now.

column1: Gammothra the Tormentor^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Primal Mighthorn^Primal Mighthorn^The Wondrous Bloodspore^^^Slay Gammothra and return the Head of Gammothra to Primal Mighthorn at the Bloodspore Plains in the Borean Tundra.^Magnataur live in prides
column2: much like lions: one or two dominant males and several females along with their offspring. In the case of Gammoth
column3: the magnataur den west of here
column4: Gammothra is the leader. It is Gammothra that controls this magnataur population and therefore it is Gammothra that must be slain to prevent any type of magnataur uprising. Take this pouch of crushed bloodspore flower to Gammoth. Use the powder from the pouch to weaken Gammothra and then slay him! Return his head to me as proof.

column1: Trophies of Gammoth^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Primal Mighthorn^Garrosh Hellscream^The Wondrous Bloodspore^^^Take the Head of Gammothra to Garrosh Hellscream in Warsong Hold.^We cannot take all of the credit for this Horde victory
column2: <name>. It was you who risked your life to test the bloodspore and it was you who ultimately put an end to Gammothra. Honor us by returning to Warsong Hold and presenting the head of Gammothra to Lord Hellscream.

column1: Deploy the Shake-n-Quake!^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Abner Fizzletorque^Abner Fizzletorque^Scouting the Sinkholes^^^Abner Fizzletorque at Fizzcrank Airstrip wants you to use the Shake-n-Quake 5000 to collapse the Nerubian tunnels and defeat Lord Kryxix.^Behold
column2: the machine that will save us from the Nerubian threat! <Abner beams with pride as he presents the finished bot.> Take this remote control with you
column3: and go out to the southernmost of the Nerubian sinkholes in the Geyser Fields. Use the remote to activate the Shake-n-Quake 5000. It will do the rest on its own. Don't be surprised if the quake it creates attracts the attention of a Nerubian leader. In fact
column4: it would be a great opportunity to finish off the Nerubian offensive.

column1: Massive Moth Omelet?^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Massive Glowing Egg^Bloodmage Laurith^^^^Take the Massive Glowing Egg to Bloodmage Laurith at the Bloodspore Plains in the Borean Tundra.^This egg was obviously important to somebody
column2: as the corpse nearby can attest. As you look the egg over you notice that it has already been tagged for shipment to the Bloodspore Plains
column3: care of Bloodmage Laurith. That's just east of here! Collect the egg and take it to the expectant Bloodmage.

column1: Finding Pilot Tailspin^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Fizzcrank Fullthrottle^Iggy "Tailspin" Cogtoggle^^Re-Cursive^A Little Bit of Spice^Locate Iggy "Tailspin" Cogtoggle in the Geyser Fields.^I should've flown the mission myself. It's not that I don't trust Tailspin. Far from it. Heck
column2: he was the best wingman I ever flew with. No
column3: it's just that it's my responsibility to lead a mission of such import. I sent Tailspin out with our fastest recon squadron to gather information about the Nerubian infestation in the middle of the Geyser Fields. The last report we received placed his squadron in the pools to the far south and just west of the Nerubian sinkholes. Find Tailspin
column4: <name>.

column1: A Little Bit of Spice^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Iggy "Tailspin" Cogtoggle^Iggy "Tailspin" Cogtoggle^A Little Bit of Spice^Finding Pilot Tailspin^^Iggy "Tailspin" Cogtoggle in the Scalding Pools wants you to gather 4 Gorloc Spice Pouches.^The wolves have been pawing through the wreckage ever since the crash and I'm afraid they consumed the microfilm from our mission in the process. I have a plan to recover that microfilm
column2: but I need your help to make it work. To the south and east
column3: in the Flood Plains
column4: live creatures called gorlocs. They prepare their foods with noxious spices
column5: which would sicken any other creature. If you can gather enough of the spice pouches from gorloc steam belchers or gorloc waddlers
column6: I can make the wolf bait.

column1: A Time for Heroes^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^General Arlos^Sergeant Hammerhill^A Time for Heroes^Enlistment Day^^Report to Sergeant Hammerhill at Valiance Keep.^It's good to have you among us
column2: <name>. We've all heard of your past deeds. As you know
column3: King Wrynn is moving great armies into Northrend to meet those of Arthas. But armies are nothing without true heroes to inspire and lead them. I want you to be that hero for my men. Fight alongside them against the Scourge that lays siege to our stronghold. Report to Sergeant Hammerhill outside the inner hold. Valiance Keep cannot fall. The future of our campaign depends on it.

column1: Lupus Pupus^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Iggy "Tailspin" Cogtoggle^Iggy "Tailspin" Cogtoggle^A Little Bit of Spice^^^Iggy "Tailspin" Cogtoggle in the Scalding Pools wants you to bring him 8 pieces of Microfilm.^Whatever you do
column2: don't eat this bait yourself. Just set it down in the vicinity of an oil-soaked wolf. If they're desperate enough to eat the microfilm
column3: they'll come running when they smell the bait. Simply wait for nature to take its course and then all you need to do is search the
column4: uh... byproduct for the film. I'd offer you my special lupus pupus scupus for the job
column5: but I left it back at the airstrip. I'm afraid you'll have to conduct the... err... search the old-fashioned way.

column1: The Ultrasonic Screwdriver^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^The Ultrasonic Screwdriver^Crafty Wobblesprocket^The Ultrasonic Screwdriver^^^Deliver the Ultrasonic Screwdriver to Crafty Wobblesprocket at Fizzcrank Airstrip.^The unit you just dismantled had this inside of its mechanical innards. It looks pretty complicated... certainly someone back at the airstrip would want to take a look at it. Maybe Crafty Wobblesprocket?

Master and Servant^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Crafty Wobblesprocket^Crafty Wobblesprocket^The Ultrasonic Screwdriver^^^Use the Ultrasonic Screwdriver to reprogram 15 robots and then return to Crafty Wobblesprocket at Fizzcrank Airstrip.^The Ultrasonic Screwdriver is the ultimate tool. It can do anything to mechanical stuff! Head back into the pools and dismantle a number of Mechazod's robots. Then all you have to do is use the screwdriver on their remains
column2: and I'm betting that they'll turn to our side
column3: for a short time anyway. I'm pretty sure it won't work on the mechagnomes
column4: so don't even bother with them. Oh
column5: and if you want to take anything from the robot's insides
column6: you'll want to do so before using the screwdriver!

column1: Traversing the Rift^71^All^Borean Tundra^Surristrasz^Archmage Berinand^Taking Wing^^^Surristrasz wants you to travel to Coldarra. Once there
column2: you are to speak with Archmage Berinand.^I've been mindful of your efforts
column3: mortal. Do not feign surprise. Surely you've felt my eye upon you. The time has come to peel back a layer of darkness from your mind. There are stark truths that you have grown ready to accept. Before hearing the tale
column4: you shall be shown firsthand what we face. Put your affairs in order
column5: <class>....

column1: Lefty Loosey
column2: Righty Tighty^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Jinky Wingnut^Jinky Wingnut^Distress Call^^^Dismantle Twonky
column4: Max Blasto
column5: and The Grinder
column6: and then report back to Jinky Wingnut at Fizzcrank Airstrip.^Okay
column7: I think we're ready for the penultimate assault... before you can bring down Mechazod
column8: you're going to have to dismantle his lieutenants first! You'll find Twonky
column10: Max Blasto
column11: and The Grinder at the West Point
column12: North Point
column13: Mid Point and South Point stations
column14: respectively. To get them to show up
column15: just turn the valves at the stations to mess up whatever they're trying to do out there. You can't miss the places

column1: A Soldier in Need^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Medic Hawthorn^Medic Hawthorn^^^^Medic Hawthorn
column2: outside of Valiance Keep
column3: wants you to go inside the Stormbreaker's hold and retrieve Hawthorn's Anti-Venom from a crate of First Aid Supplies.^You there! Please
column4: I need your help. This soldier will succumb to the cryptfiends' venom unless we act immediately. I've managed to slow down the poison
column5: but without a suitable supply of antidote I cannot counteract it. I was promised a new shipment of anti-venom in the Stormbreaker's most recent trip from the south. Go inside its hold and search for a chest of first aid supplies. Hurry
column6: <class>! We can't afford to lose any more men unnecessarily.

column1: Notify Arlos^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Admiral Cantlebree^General Arlos^^Cultists Among Us^Enemies of the Light
column2: A Diplomatic Mission^Speak to General Arlos inside the Inner Hold at Valiance Keep.^We must notify General Arlos at once. I've known the captain for a long time and
column3: believe me
column4: he is one of the more careful ones. Who knows how many cultists have been smuggled into our settlements in Northrend in other ships? This could be disastrous.

column1: Enemies of the Light^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Harbinger Vurenn^Harbinger Vurenn^Enemies of the Light^Notify Arlos^^Harbinger Vurenn wants you to fight the Cultist Necrolytes near Farshire to the north of Valiance Keep and retrieve the Cultist Communique from them.^Not so fast there. I don't know about you
column2: <class>
column3: but I was hardly convinced by the general's words. They rung unsure... as if they were not his own. Something's amiss here. All of our efforts to collaborate have been blocked and delayed. It is time we took a more independent approach. If we're to learn more about the cultists inside the keep... perhaps we should investigate those outside. Intelligence reports a small group of them aiding the Scourge north of here. See if they carry any clues.

column1: Further Investigation^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Harbinger Vurenn^Vindicator Yaala^Enemies of the Light^^^Bring the Cultist Communique to Vindicator Yaala inside the inn in Valiance Keep.^I'm afraid this is a matter I must delegate to one of my operatives... someone who can work in secret. Keep the evidence with you and take it to Vindicator Yaala inside the inn. Tell her I sent you and speak of this matter to no one else. We do not know who might be working for the cult.

The Hunt is On^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Vindicator Yaala^Vindicator Yaala^Enemies of the Light^^^Vindicator Yaala wants you to use the Oculus of the Exorcist in three different locations in Valiance Keep to uncover and defeat Cult of the Damned members.^I've made it my business to learn as much as possible about the vile death cult
column2: including their secret language. Vurenn was right. The cultists mention disguised operatives in various locations in Valiance Keep: the lower docks
column3: the jail inside the inner hold and in the inn's kitchen. Take this oculus. Use it at those three locations - anyone that has recently used the cult's necromancy will be enshrouded by a dark aura. Take care of the cultists before something nefarious happens.

column1: Emergency Protocol: Section 8.2
column2: Paragraph C^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Iggy "Tailspin" Cogtoggle^Iggy "Tailspin" Cogtoggle^A Little Bit of Spice^^^Recover 6 Fizzcrank Pilot Insignia from the bodies of Fizzcrank Recon Pilots and return them to Iggy "Tailspin" Cogtoggle in the Scalding Pools.^Injured or not
column3: as squadron commander
column4: I'm responsible for locating and returning the insignia of all fallen pilots under my command. In all the years I've flown with Fizzcrank
column5: we've never failed to return the signet of a pilot. My injuries make it dangerous for me to stray far from the safety of the wreckage
column6: but perhaps you would be willing to help me recover the insignia? In the meantime
column7: I'll make preparations to carry out my final duty as squadron commander.

column1: Emergency Protocol: Section 8.2
column2: Paragraph D^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Iggy "Tailspin" Cogtoggle^Iggy "Tailspin" Cogtoggle^A Little Bit of Spice^^^Iggy "Tailspin" Cogtoggle wants you to scuttle the Eastern Wreck
column3: a Southern Wreck
column4: and a Northwestern Wreck.^There's only one more thing left to do before I can finally return to the airstrip and make my report. Section 8.2
column5: paragraph D of the emergency protocol requires me to scuttle as much of the wreckage as possible
column6: in order to prevent our technology from falling into enemy hands. I'll give you my torch if you agree to help me complete this last duty. I don't want to think about what the Horde's goblin allies will do if these machines fall into their hands.

column1: The Siege^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Sergeant Hammerhill^Sergeant Hammerhill^A Time for Heroes^^^Sergeant Hammerhill wants you to kill 6 Crypt Crawlers in the Sands of Nasam outside of Valiance Keep.^Well
column2: well
