column3: well. It's good to see Arlos bring out the big guns. Don't get me wrong - our lads are doing the best they can
column4: but someone of your renown fighting alongside them could really turn the tides for us. I'm not sure how much longer we can hold out against these undead Nerubians. What do you say you get out there and kill me some creepers? Show these boys how it's done.

column1: The Gearmaster^72^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Jinky Wingnut^Fizzcrank Fullthrottle^Distress Call^^^Research the Gearmaster's Manual and return Mechazod's Head to Fizzcrank Fullthrottle.^Gearmaster Mechazod is insane! He says that he offers us immortality by removing this so-called 'Curse of the Flesh'
column2: but what he's really making are robotic slaves! <name>
column3: we're pretty certain that he's still at the pumping station out in the middle of the pools to the east. The last we saw of him
column4: he was in the command hut up top. Go up there and research his stuff. You must confront Mechazod if gnomes everywhere
column5: ... no
column6: everyone everywhere
column7: are to stay alive!

column1: Unfit for Death^72^All^Borean Tundra^Zaza^Zaza^Unfit for Death^A Mission Statement^^Zaza at the D.E.H.T.A. Encampment in the Borean Tundra wants you to use the Pile of Fake Furs to trap 8 Nesingwary Trappers.^Just south of us the caribou used to roam freely
column2: peacefully. Then Nesingwary showed up and everything changed. Now the caribou are in a perpetual state of frenzy
column3: always in a panic. They are stalked by the hunters and trappers hidden in the field. Nesingwary's executioners are unfit for death. They must feel the torture that they put the caribou through! Take this pile of fake furs and lay it upon their caribou traps to the south. Watch as the hunters are caught in their own deadly traps!

column1: Ears of Our Enemies^72^All^Borean Tundra^Arch Druid Lathorius^Arch Druid Lathorius^^A Mission Statement^Can't Get Ear-nough...
column2: The Assassination of Harold Lane^Arch Druid Lathorius at the D.E.H.T.A. Encampment in the Borean Tundra has said that he will reward you should you bring him 15 Nesingwary Lackey Ears.^Whether they be treasure seekers or bloodthirsty hunters of the wastes
column3: any being that supports Nesingwary and dares to strike at our beloved wildlife shall be considered an enemy of D.E.H.T.A. Should you slay these filthy Nesingwary sympathizers
column4: bring me proof of their demise and you shall be rewarded with a blessing from the druids of D.E.H.T.A.

column1: Can't Get Ear-nough...^72^All^Borean Tundra^Arch Druid Lathorius^Arch Druid Lathorius^^Ears of Our Enemies^^Arch Druid Lathorius at the D.E.H.T.A. Outpost in the Borean Tundra has said that he will reward you should you bring him 15 Nesingwary Lackey Ears.^Whether they be treasure seekers or bloodthirsty hunters of the wastes
column2: any being that supports Nessingwary and does dare strike at our beloved wildlife shall be considered an enemy of D.E.H.T.A. Should you slay these filthy Nesingwary sympathizers
column3: bring me proof of their demise and you shall be rewarded with a blessing from the druids of D.E.H.T.A.

column1: The Culler Cometh^72^All^Borean Tundra^Zaza^Zaza^Unfit for Death^^The Assassination of Harold Lane^Zaza at the D.E.H.T.A. Encampment in the Borean Tundra wants you to kill Karen the Culler.^Near the southern end of this bluff is where you will find the treacherous leader of the caribou trappers. She is a savage like no other
column2: making a mockery out of the carcasses of the slain animals: drinking from their blood and howling to the moons! Find this murderer
column3: Karen
column4: and end her worthless existence. Prepare yourself properly
column5: <name>. Karen the Culler has indulged in the riches that Nesingwary has lavished upon her! She will be well armed and guarded by lackeys.

column1: Happy as a Clam^72^All^Borean Tundra^Hierophant Cenius^Hierophant Cenius^Happy as a Clam^A Mission Statement^^Hierophant Cenius at the D.E.H.T.A. Encampment in the Borean Tundra wants you to kill 10 Loot Crazed Divers.^To the west of us you will find Lake Kum'uya. It is
column2: as far as we know
column3: the only freshwater giant clam habitat in the world. Of course Nesingwary's lackeys are now using the lake as a giant pearl farm. They must be stopped! A lesson must be taught to those that would think to endanger an entire species. Go to Lake Kum'uya and locate the loot crazed divers. Slay them until the water runs red! Return to me when a proper example has been made!

column1: The Abandoned Reach^72^All^Borean Tundra^Hierophant Cenius^Hierophant Liandra^Happy as a Clam^^^Seek out Hierophant Liandra at the Abandoned Reach.^We have just gotten word from Liandra that mercenaries hired by Nesingwary are moving goods off the beach and onto the main Nesingwary shipping vessel. No doubt they plan on making a fortune from their murderous trade! She has asked that we send assistance to the Abandoned Reach
column2: directly south of here on the beachfront of the Borean Tundra. Make haste
column3: Liandra awaits you there!

column1: Not On Our Watch^72^All^Borean Tundra^Hierophant Liandra^Hierophant Liandra^Happy as a Clam^^^Hierophant Liandra at the Abandoned Reach in the Borean Tundra wants you to recover 12 Shipments of Animal Parts.^Strewn across this beach
column2: amidst the flotsam and jetsam
column3: are crates and sacks of animal parts. It would seem that Nesingwary is in cahoots with the Northsea Freebooters. Those dirty pirates are transporting the goods that Nesingwary's murderous lackeys gather offshore. No doubt they will end up in the homes and on the backs of wealthy
column4: unscrupulous individuals across Azeroth. This won't happen. Not on our watch. Bring me all shipments that you find upon this beach. They'll never have them!

column1: The Nefarious Clam Master...^72^All^Borean Tundra^Hierophant Liandra^Hierophant Cenius^Happy as a Clam^^The Assassination of Harold Lane^Slay Clam Master K and return to Hierophant Cenius at the D.E.H.T.A. Encampment.^It's despicable
column2: really
column3: to anoint one's self as the "Clam Master
column4: as if they hold mastery over the creatures of the sea. None may make such claims! This Clam Master" must be found and slain. He was last seen at the wreckage just off the coast of the Abandoned Reach. Find him and kill him. Once this is done
column5: return to Hierophant Cenius at the D.E.H.T.A. Encampment
column6: north of here
column7: and let her know that the mission was a success.

column1: Give Fizzcrank the News^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Iggy "Tailspin" Cogtoggle^Fizzcrank Fullthrottle^A Little Bit of Spice^^Scouting the Sinkholes^Make your way back to Fizzcrank Airstrip and speak with Fizzcrank Fullthrottle.^Would you be willing to head back to the airstrip and let Fizzcrank know that I'll be along shortly to give my formal report? I've got to deal with the wreckage of my flying machine
column2: and then I'll be on my way. I'll be certain that Fizzcrank knows that he has you to thank for my survival and the recovery effort. I only wonder what the old man would've done himself if he'd been flying with us. I miss those days.

column1: Gaining the Advantage^70^All^Shattrath City^Emissary Mordin^Emissary Mordin^^^^Bring 8 Nether Residue to Emissary Mordin in Shattrath City.^The troops of the Shattered Sun Offensive will need every advantage they can get to beat back the allies of Kil'Jaeden. My colleagues in Stormwind have created oils which will strengthen the blades and armor of our troops. The key ingredient
column2: nether residue
column3: pervades Outland -- if you know where to look. Any master herbalist
column4: skinner
column5: or miner who knows the signs can gather it while plying <his/her> trade. Those herbs
column6: ores
column7: and beasts native to Outland may all bear the residue.

column1: Help Those That Cannot Help Themselves^72^All^Borean Tundra^Arch Druid Lathorius^Arch Druid Lathorius^Help Those That Cannot Help Themselves^A Mission Statement^^Arch Druid Lathorius at the D.E.H.T.A. Encampment in the Borean Tundra wants you to use the D.E.H.T.A. Trap Smasher to free 8 Mammoth Calves.^They're majestic beasts
column2: aren't they? <Lathorius points towards the mammoths of the northern tundra.> With each passing day their numbers diminish. Demons that call themselves hunters slay the beasts for sport and riches. <Lathorius' face contorts with anger.> It's the whimpers that drive me to madness
column3: <name>. You can hear them
column4: carried by the wind. The mammoth calves
column5: trapped in the hunters' vile traps
column6: call out to us. Take this hammer and smash those traps. Free the calves!

column1: Sunfury Attack Plans^70^All^Netherstorm^Lord Torvos^Lord Torvos^^^^Lord Torvos in Shattrath wants you to capture the Sunfury Attack Plans.^As we press the offensive on Quel'Danas
column2: we've discovered that Kael'thas' minions are planning a counterattack. By ordering the Sunfury blood elves
column3: based in Netherstorm
column4: to attack our operations in Outland
column5: he hopes to draw troops and attention away from the Sunwell. We must not allow this to happen
column6: <name>. Each and every blade is needed on the front lines. Go to Netherstorm and capture their attack plans. Any of the Sunfury blood elves up there could be in possession of the plans. Good luck
column7: <name>.

column1: Khu'nok Will Know^72^All^Borean Tundra^Arch Druid Lathorius^Khu'nok the Behemoth^Help Those That Cannot Help Themselves^^^Take the Orphaned Mammoth Calf to Khu'nok the Behemoth in the Borean Tundra.^Although you have acted valiantly in freeing the trapped calves
column2: many of them will still die. You see
column3: without a caretaker
column4: these calves must fend for themselves in the wild. But there is a way! Hope yet remains! North of here in the mammoth fields
column5: bordering the Scalding Pools
column6: you will find Khu'nok the Behemoth: a mammoth as wise as he is ancient. Take this mammoth orphan and present it to Khu'nok. He will know what to do.

column1: Kaw the Mammoth Destroyer^72^All^Borean Tundra^Khu'nok the Behemoth^Arch Druid Lathorius^Help Those That Cannot Help Themselves^^The Assassination of Harold Lane^Kill Kaw the Mammoth Destroyer and recover Kaw's War Halberd. Deliver Kaw's War Halberd to Arch Druid Lathorius at the D.E.H.T.A. Encampment in the Borean Tundra.^You cannot defeat the being responsible for the slaughter of my kind by yourself. The mammoths of the tundra will help you! Venture forth to the plains and find a mammoth bull. He will allow you to mount him and control his movements and actions. Ride upon his back and find Kaw
column2: north of here at Kaw's Roost. Together
column3: you will be the instrument of Kaw's demise. Destroy Kaw's armies and take from Kaw his coveted war halberd. Return to Lathorius at the D.E.H.T.A. Encampment should you succeed.

column1: The Multiphase Survey^70^Alliance^Nagrand^Harbinger Haronem^Harbinger Haronem^^^^Harbinger Haronem in Shattrath City wants you to use the Multiphase Spectrographic Goggles to take 6 Multiphase Readings.^I'm sure that 'gnomish inventor' is a crackpot. He was babbling about some dark distortions that have begun to appear in the Spirit Fields around Oshu'gun in Nagrand. According to him
column2: these
column3: uh
column4: multiphase... um
column5: spectro-goggles will allow the wearer to see the distortions and take readings from them. He insisted that recording this data was fundamental to our campaign at the Sunwell. I think he's nuts
column6: but I'm under orders to investigate anything that might help. Would you mind taking some readings?

column1: Load'er Up!^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Fezzix Geartwist^Fezzix Geartwist^^^The Power of the Elements^Help Jenny make her way from the crash site to Fezzix Geartwist at Taunka'le Village without losing all her cargo.^Have you seen the flying machines buzzing around? That's gnomish innovation at its finest. I've long waited to get my hands on some of their technology and a perfect opportunity has presented itself. One of their recon wings crashed in the Scalding Pools
column2: in the southwest part of the Geyser Fields. Blow this whistle near one of the crashed machines and my trusty mule
column3: Jenny will answer. She'll follow you and carry the salvage
column4: but you must keep her safe. She'll begin to drop the cargo if attacked.

column1: Ned
column2: Lord of Rhinos...^72^All^Borean Tundra^Killinger the Den Watcher^Killinger the Den Watcher^^A Mission Statement^The Assassination of Harold Lane^Killinger the Den Watcher at the D.E.H.T.A. Encampment in the Borean Tundra wants you to kill Nedar
column3: Lord of Rhinos and his companion
column4: "Lunchbox."^West of here
column5: on the high bluffs above Lake Kum'uya
column6: roams a despicable being known as Nedar. The self proclaimed "Lord of Rhinos" hunts the wastes for the injured or young - rhinos unable to defend themselves against Ned's cowardly attacks. To add insult to injury
column7: Ned has raised a rhino of his own to become his mount and bodyguard. It is a rare thing that D.E.H.T.A. would ever call for the death of an animal
column8: but Ned's tainted rhino must be disposed of... Kill them both and return to me.

column1: Adversarial Blood^70^All^Skettis^Hazzik^Hazzik^Hazzik's Bargain^^Terokk's Downfall
column2: Tokens of the Descendants^Find the Skull Piles in the middle of the summoning circles of Skettis. Summon and defeat each of the descendants by using 10 Time-Lost Scrolls at the Skull Pile. Return to Hazzik at Blackwind Landing.^The descendants held prisoner by the Skettis talonpriests are listed in this book: Gezzarak the Huntress
column3: Karrog the crystal giant
column4: the heretic known as Darkscreecher Akkarai and Vakkiz the Windrager. They will all need to be slain before Terokk returns to this world. You will need the scrolls carried by the time-lost arakkoa to call them forth at the summoning circles in Skettis. These are powerful beings you will be facing; you would do well to bring friends.

column1: Emergency Supplies^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Crashed Recon Pilot^Fezzix Geartwist^^^^Collect 7 Gnomish Emergency Toolkits from the bodies of crashed Fizzcrank Recon Pilots and bring them to Fezzix Geartwist at Taunka'le Village.^Rifling through the dead gnome's possessions
column2: you come across a small packet filled with rations
column3: tools
column4: and a handy roll of gnomish duct tape. The contents of these kits might prove helpful to Fezzix Geartwist when it comes time for him to reassemble the wreckage of the gnomish flying machines. Bringing a few of these kits to Fezzix might just be worth a nice bonus.

column1: Ride to Taunka'le Village^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Ambassador Talonga^Sage Earth and Sky^Ride to Taunka'le Village^Taking Back Mightstone Quarry^^Speak with Sage Earth and Sky at Taunka'le Village.^<race>
column2: the chieftain is making me wait... time that Taunka'le does not have! There has been talk of your prowess. Rather than wait for Garrosh to send help
column3: I ask you to go and help my people. Taunka'le village lies far to the northeast. Follow the road east out of the hold
column4: turning north at the intersection. Not long after
column5: you will come to another intersection. Follow the path east
column6: passing south and then east of the great pools along the flood plains. Speak with Sage Earth and Sky when you arrive.

column1: Death From Above^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Sergeant Hammerhill^Sergeant Hammerhill^A Time for Heroes^^^Sergeant Hammerhill wants you to use the Reinforced Net to help you slay 6 Scourged Flamespitters outside of Valiance Keep.^We're doing a good job of holding the front lines against these bugs. Some of these cheeky fiends
column2: however
column3: can fly over the aforementioned front lines and are really beating down on our inner defenses. I've requisitioned reinforced fishing nets from our civilian ships. If you've got a good enough throwing arm
column4: they'll help you knock the enemy out of the sky. Thin their numbers so that our defenses can hold the keep.

column1: What Are They Up To?^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Sage Earth and Sky^Sage Earth and Sky^Ride to Taunka'le Village^^^Investigate the area surrounding the Fizzcrank Pumping Station. Then
column2: return to Sage Earth and Sky at Taunka'le Village.^The gnomes have run into some trouble in the pools to the west. It serves them right as they have been fouling up the land with their so-called inventions. I want you to go out to their pumping station and observe what has befallen them. Return to me after.

column1: The Assassination of Harold Lane^72^All^Borean Tundra^Arch Druid Lathorius^Arch Druid Lathorius^^Ears of Our Enemies
column2: The Culler Cometh
column3: The Nefarious Clam Master...
column4: Kaw the Mammoth Destroyer
column5: Ned
column6: Lord of Rhinos...^^Arch Druid Lathorius at the D.E.H.T.A. Outpost in the Borean Tundra wants you to kill Harold Lane.^You have done much for the animals of the Borean Tundra
column7: <name>. Nesingwary's lackeys have been beaten back and taught a lesson that they will not soon forget. Harold Lane
column8: the primary agent responsible for the mass slaughters in Nagrand
column9: has been identified as the man in charge of Nesingwary operations in the tundra. He is stationed at Lake Kum'uya
column10: west of here. <Lathorius hands you an intricately carved oak horn.> Find Lane and kill him. Use this horn should you require our aid.

column1: The Power of the Elements^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Dorain Frosthoof^Dorain Frosthoof^^Load'er Up!^Patching Up^Dorain Frosthoof at Taunka'le Village wants you to use the Windsoul Totem to gather the energy of 10 Steam Ragers.^I kept trying to tell that silly goblin his machines are unreliable. But the power of the elements; that is deep and abiding. When my apprenticeship is over
column2: I will wield their full power. What I know now should be sufficient to help out our friend Fezzix
column3: though. Take this windsoul totem and plant it near any of the steam ragers to the west of the village. The totem will gather up the energies of slain elementals. Return the fully charged totem to me and I'll do the rest.

column1: Patching Up^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Fezzix Geartwist^Fezzix Geartwist^^The Power of the Elements^Shrouds of the Scourge^Fezzix Geartwist at Taunka'le Village wants you to bring him 5 Steam Cured Hides.^Remember all that gnomish duct tape you brought me? Well
column2: I've found a use for it. The body of this flying machine is so banged up in places
column3: that I'm going to need to reinforce it if I ever hope to fly. Dorain over there has been telling me that the taunka use steam cured caribou leather for making watertight containers. Marsh caribou live all around the village and in the Flood Plains to the south. Get the best hides you can find and cure them over the steam vents in the Geyser Fields.

column1: Master the Storm^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Sage Earth and Sky^Sage Earth and Sky^Ride to Taunka'le Village^^^Defeat the Storm Tempest and then return to Sage Earth and Sky at Taunka'le Village.^From what you describe
column2: the creatures of metal should be easy to deal with. But first
column3: you must master the storm. Behind me in the lodge is a totem. When you are ready
column4: focus your will upon it and the storm will come. You must defeat the storm and in so doing take its essence into yourself. If others are there
column5: it is enough that you all work together to defeat it. Return to me after
column6: <class>.

column1: Weakness to Lightning^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Sage Earth and Sky^Sage Earth and Sky^Ride to Taunka'le Village^^^While weakened by the Power of the Storm
column2: destroy any 15 of the robotic units
column3: except the mechagnomes
column4: in the greater pools area surrounding the Fizzcrank Pumping Station.^You now have the power of the storm within you. I will give you the means to focus that power and weaken the robots in the pools. Take this lightning rod. Use it against the robotic creations of the mechagnomes you find within the greater pools area to the west. Do not worry about using it against the mechagnomes themselves; Greatmother Taiga has other plans for them. Once the robots are weakened by the power of the storm
column5: dismantle them utterly!

column1: Plug the Sinkholes^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Sergeant Hammerhill^Sergeant Hammerhill^A Time for Heroes^^Nick of Time
column2: Distress Call
column3: Word on the Street
column4: Farshire^Sergeant Hammerhill wants you to use the Incendiary Explosives to collapse the sinkholes southwest and northwest of Valiance Keep.^The Scourge are showing no sign of letting up
column5: <name>. It's those blasted sinkholes; they connect to tunnels all the way to Icecrown for all we know. Giant undead worms burrow under the ground to create them. If there's something years of mining has taught me it's that without support beams
column6: tunnels will cave in easily after an explosion. Take these explosives and place them at the entrance to the sinkholes up on the ridge beyond the beach to the west. Come back after you've collapsed them.

column1: Breaking Through^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Chieftain Wintergale^Chieftain Wintergale^^Words of Power^The Fall of Taunka'le Village^Defeat Prince Valanar and his lieutenants
column2: Vanthryn the Merciless and Luthion the Vile
column3: then report to Chieftain Wintergale at Taunka'le Village.^On the lowest tier of the Temple City
column4: there is a gray altar bathed in light. Step into it to gain entry to the dread necropolis Naxxanar. Be cautious
column5: <name>. Prince Valanar will certainly be defended by his personal retainers
column6: who will give their lives to keep you from ascending to the top level of the necropolis. You must find your way through the necropolis to the prince's seat. If you fail to defeat him
column7: <name>
column8: I fear my people will never know the safety Icemist offers.

column1: Souls of the Decursed^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Greatmother Taiga^Greatmother Taiga^^^Defeat the Gearmaster^Use The Greatmother's Soulcatcher to capture the souls of 10 Fizzcrank mechagnomes. Then
column2: return to Greatmother Taiga at Taunka'le Village once you have done so.^The mechagnomes in the pools to the west are a great mystery to us. They appeared not long after the gnomes disappeared from their pumping station and its environs. They are an unnatural danger and must be dealt with. Take this soulcatcher and use it on the remains of the mechagnomes to capture their souls. When you return
column3: we will set them free so that we might find out what happened.

column1: Reading the Meters^71^All^Borean Tundra^Archmage Berinand^Archmage Berinand^Reading the Meters^^^Archmage Berinand at the Transitus Shield has asked you to collect the readings from his instruments in Coldarra.^I had hoped that the Nexus' impact was limited to this region. Recently though
column2: reports have flooded in from all over Azeroth suggesting that geologic instability is growing exponentially! I need the Nexus monitored regularly as I work to develop a solution. I've placed sensitive instruments around Coldarra
column3: disguised as Malygos' scrying orbs. One lies in the trench near the Nexus
column4: and three are hidden in the structures around the valley's perimeter. Visit each and return to me with their readings.

column1: Military? What Military?^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Gerald Green^Plagued Grain^Farshire^^Reference Material^Gerald Green in Farshire wants you to go into the mine to the north and find out what happened to the military detachment that was sent there.^There's Scourge everywhere
column2: <class>. We've organized the farmers and miners into a militia
column3: but this just won't cut it. The one detachment of troops that Valiance Keep sent is defending the mine. We haven't heard from them in days! If you really wish to help us
column4: why don't you go to the mine and see what's going on? Maybe we can get them to send us some reinforcements.

column1: Pernicious Evidence^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Plagued Grain^Gerald Green^Farshire^^Take No Chances^Return to Gerald Green in Farshire.^The sacks of grain emanate the foul stench you've come to associate with the Plague. This probably explains what happened to the footmen defending the mine. You'd best bring word back to Gerald Green.
It's Time for Action^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Gerald Green^Gerald Green^Farshire^^^Gerald Green in Farshire wants you to kill 14 Plagued Scavengers.^Well
column2: <name>. With the last of our military in Farshire dead or worse
column3: we can do but one thing: fight these Scourge ourselves. We have deployed militia in what remains of Farshire. Without your help
column4: they've but little hope of winning. Go and lend them a hand. Me and the lads will watch this path. We can't let the Scourge break through!

column1: Fruits of Our Labor^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Gerald Green^Gerald Green^Farshire^^^Go to the mine in Farshire
column2: obtain the Cart Release Key from Captain Jacobs and use it to release the ore cart. Return to Gerald Green in Farshire when you've completed this task.^The Scourge just keeps coming... but we can't give up! Listen
column3: <name>. Inside that mine there's a cart with the last of the ore the Alliance is going to see on this side of the continent for a long time. The problem is the cart release is locked. When the military went in there
column4: Captain Jacobs commandeered all the important equipment
column5: including the cart release key. The plague that affected the soldiers in the mine must also have affected Jacobs. Get the key from him and salvage the ore.

column1: Postponing the Inevitable^71^All^Borean Tundra^Archmage Berinand^Archmage Berinand^Reading the Meters^^^Archmage Berinand in the Transitus Shield wants you to use the Interdimensional Refabricator near the rift in the Nexus.^I've determined the cause of the instability! Azeroth's ley lines are being redirected to the Nexus. It's fascinating! If only I could spend the remainder of my days studying this anomaly.... Sadly
column2: I must focus on the immediate crisis. The influx of arcane energies is tearing a rift between dimensions. Deep inside the Nexus
column3: the fabric of our universe is being weakened. I cannot stop it
column4: but I've discovered a way to slow it down. Take this into the Nexus and activate it near the forming rift.

column1: Cleaning Up the Pools^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Iron Eyes^Iron Eyes^^^^Collect 15 Fizzcrank Spare Parts and deliver them to Iron Eyes at Taunka'le Village.^<A single tear rolls down the face of Iron Eyes.> I have heard that you are heading back into the pools to the west. I have something for you to do while you are out there
column2: <race>. The gnomes
column3: who care nothing for the land
column4: have polluted it with their machinery. I want you to pick up any spare parts that you come across. Return them to me here. I will see to it that they are properly disposed of before we leave this place for good.

column1: The Sub-Chieftains^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Sage Earth and Sky^Sage Earth and Sky^Ride to Taunka'le Village^^^Defeat Twonky
column3: Max Blasto
column4: and The Grinder
column5: and then report back to Sage Earth and Sky at Taunka'le Village.^It is known that Gearmaster Mechazod has four sub-chieftains that manage the robots in the pools. We must put an end to them! Our longrunners and snow trackers say that if you were to turn the valves at the west point
column6: north point
column7: mid point and south point stations
column8: each of his sub-chieftains would come quickly to prevent you from fouling their operations. The stations are centered on the spinning lights in the pools surrounding the pumping station. Hurry
column9: <name>!

column1: Reference Material^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Jeremiah Hawning^Jeremiah Hawning^Reference Material^Military? What Military?^^Jeremiah Hawning wants you to retrieve the book "Fields
column2: Factories and Workshops" from the burning building next to the mine in Farshire.^I was in charge of the harvest golems - an important job until the Scourge destroyed most of our farmlands. I've an idea that would make the golems useful again
column3: however. I think I can rewire the harvest collectors so they'll give us a hand fighting the Scourge. I'm not an expert at this just yet
column4: so I'm going to need my manual. The problem is
column5: I left it at the workshop... which happens to be that burning building next to the mine. Think you could go salvage it?

column1: Defeat the Gearmaster^72^Horde^Borean Tundra^Greatmother Taiga^Greatmother Taiga^^Souls of the Decursed^^Research the Gearmaster's Manual and return Mechazod's Head to Greatmother Taiga at Taunka'le Village.^Clearly this Gearmaster Mechazod creature is not in his right mind. If his offer of a cure and immortality means all of us becoming robotic slaves then he must be stopped! The winds that guide me whisper that he's atop the pumping station out in the middle of the pools to the west. Most likely
column2: he'll be found in the command hut on top of the structure. Go inside and research his works. <name>
column3: you must confront Mechazod if we are to survive!

column1: Secrets of the Ancients^71^All^Borean Tundra^Archmage Berinand^Archmage Berinand^Secrets of the Ancients^^^Archmage Berinand in the Transitus Shield wants you to collect 3 Glacial Splinters and 3 Magic-Bound Splinters from the Ancients in Coldarra.^It's become clear that the instability in the region has had an effect on its indigenous creatures. I've taken a particular interest in the Glacial Ancients and their recent adaptations. I suspect that their transformation into these 'Magic-bound' Ancients may hold clues to our predicament here. For my studies
column2: I'll need samples from both. Do hurry....

column1: Quickening^71^All^Borean Tundra^Archmage Berinand^Archmage Berinand^Secrets of the Ancients^^^Archmage Berinand in the Transitus Shield wants you to enter the Nexus and collect 5 Arcane Splinters from Crystalline Protectors.^Though we may be witnessing the end of our existence
column2: I can't help but marvel. I've learned more in my short time here than in decades of studies. These Ancients are being exposed to incredible levels of arcane energy. It's literally transforming them into something... different. I'm confident that there's another stage in their metamorphosis. I'll need you to actually enter the Nexus
column3: <name>
column4: and find me some evidence of their final state. Do be careful....

column1: Nuts for Berries^71^All^Borean Tundra^Librarian Serrah^Librarian Serrah^Nuts for Berries^^^Librarian Serrah in the Transitus Shield wants you to gather 10 Frostberries from the Frostberry Bushes in Coldarra.^Oh! What a relief it is to see a fresh face. I was beginning to feel we had been forsaken. Our supply lines were cut off days ago
column2: and things have been looking - well
column3: bleak. To be honest
column4: this was a suicide mission to begin with if you ask me. Maybe I'm simply not cut out for all of this violence - to say nothing of the bitter cold! I'd much rather be back in Dalaran studying ancient texts. To the point
column5: our food supply is nearly spent. Please
column6: gather what you can and bring it to me.

column1: Take No Chances^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Wendy Darren^Wendy Darren^^Pernicious Evidence^^Wendy Darren wants you to use Wendy's Torch to burn 8 sacks of Farshire Grain.^I heard what you told Gerald and I don't like it one bit. If cultists managed to poison the grain in the mines with their foul plague
column2: they could've easily done the same with the grain outside. We don't have time to sort the good grain from the bad. We must act quickly and burn it all. Take this torch and set fire to any sacks of grain you find out here. It would be a tragedy if we survived this attack only to succumb to the plague afterwards.

column1: Keep the Secret Safe^71^All^Borean Tundra^Librarian Serrah^Librarian Serrah^Nuts for Berries^^^Librarian Serrah in the Transitus Shield needs you to kill Arcane Serpents near the Nexus and collect 5 Nexus Mana Essences from them.^Our existence here depends entirely upon staying hidden. Should the shield fail
column2: even for a moment
column3: Malygos' minions would have us. One of my responsibilities is to rejuvenate the warmages' mana levels so their focus doesn't falter. With our supply lines lost
column4: I've been forced to improvise. I could use your help
column5: <name>. Very near the Nexus
column6: Arcane Serpents feast on the abundant magical energies. Once defeated
column7: they will yield a mana essence that I can make use of.

column1: Hellscream's Champion^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Garrosh Hellscream^Chieftain Wintergale^^^Message from the West^Seek out Chieftain Wintergale at Taunka'le Village.^You have faced all challenges that have been set before you and squashed them beneath your boot heel. It is because of you
column2: <name>
column3: that the Horde is now firmly entrenched in Northrend. But our work has only just begun. We must march to Icecrown and we must tear down its walls! Your next assignment begins to the east
column4: at Taunka'le Village. Our taunka allies are in dire straits and require aid. Secure transport from the stable master
column5: Durkot Wolfbrother
column6: and seek out Chieftain Wintergale at Taunka'le.

column1: Basic Training^71^All^Borean Tundra^Raelorasz^Raelorasz^Basic Training^^^Raelorasz at the Transitus Shield wants you to slay 10 Coldarra Spellweavers.^This is war
column2: mortal
column3: and we are the tip of the spear. Your little spats over land or currency pale in comparison to this conflict. We face the aspect Malygos and his entire blue dragonflight. All you need to know is that if he is victorious
column4: this world shall be no more. We are but few here
column5: and we fly against many. Our deaths are all but a certainty
column6: and our ultimate success lies in merely delaying our enemy. Go now. Busy yourself while I decide what to do with you.

column1: Drake Hunt^71^All^Borean Tundra^Raelorasz^Raelorasz^Basic Training^^Drake Hunt^Raelorasz wants you to use Raelorasz's Spear to subdue a Nexus Drake Hatchling and return it to him at the Transitus Shield.^The blues have begun to cover their drakes in mysterious runes. I must discover their significance. <Raelorasz pokes his hand with a spear and coats the tip with his blood.> Take this and use it on one of them. Wait for it to become subdued
column2: then bring it here to me before it expires. Their hatchlings feed around the northwest edge of the valley.

column1: Cultists Among Us^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Cultist Shrine^Captain "Lefty" Lugsail^^^Notify Arlos^Speak to Captain "Lefty" Lugsail above the Stormbreaker in Valiance Keep.^This altar bears all the markings of the Cult of the Damned. It appears fanatics from the mainland have made it into Northrend. It might be prudent to notify the captain of the ship. Perhaps he is to be found above deck.
Word on the Street^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Mark Hanes^Leryssa^Word on the Street^Plug the Sinkholes^^Find Leryssa at the inn in Valiance Keep^Hey
column2: <name>. There's a girl in the inn that's asking about you. Her name's Leryssa. I don't think she knows you
column3: but she said she needed your help. She sounded really desperate.

column1: Farshire^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Sergeant Hammerhill^Gerald Green^Farshire^Plug the Sinkholes^^Travel to Farshire in Borean Tundra and speak to Gerald Green.^My lads should be able to take it from here
column2: <name>. Valiance Keep is built to take a beating far worse than this. I worry about our farmlands and mine in Farshire
column3: however. We sent a full detachment to protect our mining operations right before the invasion - they should be able to defend the civilians. Gerald Green's in charge of the villagers there. There's a passage out of the northern wall out of Valiance Keep; it'll take you straight to him. See what you can do to help them.

column1: The Fall of Taunka'le Village^72^Horde^Borean Tundra^Chieftain Wintergale^Mother Tauranook^The Fall of Taunka'le Village^Breaking Through^^Speak to Mother Tauranook outside the gates of Taunka'le Village.^We are lost
column2: <name>. This place has been our home for many generations
column3: but it is no longer safe. There remains only death... Death and a memory of what used to be. I have called for the evacuation of Taunka'le. All remaining taunka must leave at once and make their way to our capital city
column4: Icemist
column5: located in the Dragonblight. <Wintergale points east.> You must help get my people to safety
column6: <name>. Mother Tauranook awaits you at the village gates. Hurry! The Scourge closes in from all sides!

column1: Across Transborea^72^Horde^Borean Tundra^Mother Tauranook^Wartook Iceborn^The Fall of Taunka'le Village^^^Escort the Taunka'le Evacuees across Transborea to Wartook Iceborn on the border of the Dragonblight.^The path across Transborea
column2: to the east
column3: is the only way to reach the Dragonblight. Many perils await you as you make your journey across the tundra. Beware the Scourge and its influence upon the beasts of the land. Rumors have started to spread about our very own taunka brothers and sisters rising from the dead and attacking caravans on their way to the Dragonblight! Defend your caravan and get the evacuees to safety! Wartook Iceborn waits for you across the bridge leading into the Dragonblight.

column1: Cracking the Code^71^All^Borean Tundra^Raelorasz^Raelorasz^Basic Training^^^Raelorasz at the Transitus Shield wants you to get the Azure Codex from Inquisitor Caleras and collect 3 Shimmering Runes from his Coldarra Spellbinders.^I sense a distinct peculiarity in the drakes here but the meaning of the runes that cover their bodies still eludes me. Without a codex
column2: it will take more time than we can afford for me to interpret them. Not far from here is a Kirin Tor traitor
column3: Caleras
column4: who is likely to have a copy of the tome I require. His underlings hold the runes I will need for my translation. Hurry
column5: mortal. Malygos gains strength with every passing moment.

column1: Cowards and Fools^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Private Brau^Ataika^Word on the Street^^^Speak to Ataika in Kaskala
column2: northeast of Valiance Keep.^Listen
column3: <name>. No offense
column4: but the operation they put Thassarian in charge of was pure suicide. A handful of our men were to launch an attack on the biggest Scourge presence in the area. Call me crazy
column5: but storming a Scourge ziggurat outside a plagued Nerubian city with a dozen men ain't my idea of fun. If you're still interested in finding Thassarian
column6: we were supposed to arrange for passage east with a tuskarr by the name of Ataika in Kaskala to the northeast. Good luck with your fool's errand.

column1: Hatching a Plan^71^All^Borean Tundra^Raelorasz^Raelorasz^Basic Training^^^Raelorasz at the Transitus Shield wants you to kill Coldarra Wyrmkin and use their frozen axes to break 5 blue dragon eggs.^Our goals here are simple. We are to remain hidden from Malygos
column2: observe his brood
column3: and thwart his efforts wherever possible. To that end
column4: I have a task for you. The blues are laying their eggs at the base of the Nexus. Exposure to so much arcane energy will surely make them hatch sooner
column5: and there's no telling what effect it will have on their spawn. I don't intend to find out. Slay the local wyrmkin and use their frozen axes to break the eggs.

column1: Buying Some Time^72^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Thassarian^Thassarian^Finding the Phylactery^^^Thassarian at the Wailing Ziggurat in Borean Tundra wants you to inflict 20 casualties against the Scourge inside the Temple City of En'kilah. Use Lurid's Bones if you need assistance.^Now that we have this phylactery
column2: I shouldn't have any problems getting the information I need. It won't take long for the Scourge in the Temple City to notice something's up
column3: however. I won't be able to fend off a full scale attack here. Or maybe I would... but I'd rather not find out. I want you to head down there and inflict some casualties. Hopefully they'll be distracted long enough for these two to spill their guts... figuratively
column4: of course. Take Lurid with you
column5: he might be of aid.

column1: Drake Hunt^71^All^Borean Tundra^Raelorasz^Raelorasz^^Drake Hunt^^Raelorasz wants you to use the Blood-tipped Spear to subdue a Nexus Drake Hatchling and return it to him at the Transitus Shield.^I need more drake hatchlings to continue researching the runes covering their bodies. They can be found around the northwest edge of the valley.... <Raelorasz pokes his hand with a spear and coats the tip with his blood.> Take this and use it on one of them. Wait for it to become subdued
column2: then bring it here to me before it expires.

column1: Puzzling...^71^All^Borean Tundra^Scintillating Fragment^Raelorasz^Puzzling...^^^Bring the Scintillating Fragment to Raelorasz at the Transitus Shield.^Something about this scrap of metal prevents you from casting it aside. Perhaps Raelorasz might be able to shed some light on its purpose.

Words of Power^72^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Thassarian^Thassarian^Finding the Phylactery^^^Thassarian at the Wailing Ziggurat wants you to go to the Temple City of En'kilah and retrieve High Priest Talet-Kha's Scroll from the Spire of Pain
column2: High Priest Naferset's Scroll from the Spire of Decay and High Priest Andorath's Scroll at the Spire of Blood.^The lich has spoken
column3: <name>. The high priests of En'kilah hold the secret to entering Naxxanar. Go to the Spire of Blood
column4: the Spire of Pain and the Spire of Decay and slay each of the priests. Return once you've obtained the three scrolls.

column1: The Cell^71^All^Borean Tundra^Raelorasz^Raelorasz^Puzzling...^^Keristrasza^Raelorasz at the Transitus Shield wants you to obtain the Prison Casing from General Cerulean and the Energy Core from Warbringer Goredrak.^You've discovered a fragment of a special prison
column2: <name>. Malygos' minions use similar prisons to hold their captured mages and other arcane entities
column3: but this prison was constructed to hold something... stronger. In hopes that the enemy of our enemy will prove to be a friend
column4: you must search for the prison's remaining fragments. They are likely to be in the possession of Malygos' most trusted underlings.

column1: Surrounded!^72^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Corporal Venn^Corporal Venn^Word on the Street^^^Corporal Venn at Death's Stand wants you to slay 7 Ziggurat Defenders.^Our situation is nearly hopeless. We were ordered to take the Wailing Ziggurat with a handful of men. We'll be lucky if we can hold this position against the Scourge. We're outnumbered
column2: injured and have no escape route. If you can take some of the pressure off of us
column3: we might be able to solidify our position. Kill some of the undead circling the structure - we'll hold off their advance.

column1: Preparing for the Worst^72^All^Borean Tundra^Utaik^Utaik^^^^Utaik wants you to gather 8 Kaskala Supplies in Kaskala.^Dark times are upon us. Karkut's spirit walks the earth and gathers the spirits of dead tuskarr. The sons of the mist have taken many of our brethren. Soon dear Kaskala will be reduced to ashes. There is hope yet. Not for us perhaps
column2: but we've sent our families to Unu'pe. We fight here so there may be a future for them. They will need supplies or they will starve. There's not enough food in Unu'pe. Salvage any supplies before it's too late for our families.

column1: Keristrasza^71^All^Borean Tundra^Keristrasza^Keristrasza^Keristrasza^The Cell^^Keristrasza wants you to speak to her when you are ready to prepare for a confrontation with Malygos.^I am... free? I was destined to spend an eternity roaming an empty abyss
column2: and now am saved? You cannot fathom my gratitude
column3: mortal. When I refused to bend to his will Malygos bound me to that prison
column4: then shattered it and scattered the pieces. Should I live one hundred of your lifetimes
column5: I shall not forget this kindness. Perhaps
column6: in time
column7: I will find ways to repay you. For now
column8: though
column9: we must focus our attention on Malygos. I am weak
column10: and there is much to be done. I need your help
column11: <name>.

column1: Not Without a Fight!^72^All^Borean Tundra^Ataika^Ataika^Not Without a Fight!^^^Ataika wants you to slay 12 Kvaldir Raiders in Kaskala.^Kaskala is a sacred place for us
column2: <race>. Our ancestors were guided here by the spirit of Tayutka herself. Now these foul creatures attack us from the mists without any provocation. We will show them that our spears are not merely for whaling. Fight alongside us
column3: friend. Perhaps my people might repay you some time in the future.

column1: Muahit's Wisdom^72^All^Borean Tundra^Ataika^Elder Muahit^Not Without a Fight!^^^Find Elder Muahit in Kaskala.^Listen
column2: <name>. Warriors like me are replaceable. If I fall
column3: my brothers and cousins will pick up my spear and fight. My people cannot survive without wise elders. Stubborn Muahit
column4: our most venerable shaman
column5: refuses to leave the altar to Tayutka in the central island. We would suffer a significant loss if he was slain by these monsters. You are an outsider
column6: maybe he'll listen to you. Show him reason... ask him to flee to the safety of Unu'pe before it's too late.

column1: Bait and Switch^71^All^Borean Tundra^Keristrasza^Keristrasza^Keristrasza^^^Keristrasza has asked you to collect 10 Crystalized Mana Shards from around Coldarra.^During my captivity I was able to learn much about Malygos. Fate now allows us to use this knowledge against him. There is a great blue dragon
column2: Saragosa
column3: who circles high above the Nexus. She serves both as the aspect's guardian and as his consort. If any serious threats arise
column4: she alerts her master of the danger. I suffered greatly at the hand of Saragosa during my captivity
column5: and now her time to die has come. First
column6: however
column7: we must fashion the perfect bait....

column1: Finding the Phylactery^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Thassarian^Thassarian^Finding the Phylactery^^^Go to Death's Stand and ride Dusk to the location of Tanathal's Phylactery. Obtain it and bring it back to Thassarian inside the Wailing Ziggurat.^No time for small talk
column2: <name>. I was sent on what was to be a suicide mission to take this ziggurat. I've accomplished my duty as a soldier
column3: now is the time to get some answers. This lich has knowledge I seek
column4: yet I cannot inflict pain to his physical body to obtain that knowledge. The lich stored his soul in a phylactery
column5: and while it remains hidden
column6: I won't be able to pry the information from him. Return to the camp and take my horse
column7: Dusk
column8: she will lead you to the phylactery. Bring it to me.

column1: Saragosa's End^71^All^Borean Tundra^Keristrasza^Keristrasza^Keristrasza^^^Keristrasza wants you to use the Power Focus to lure Saragosa
column2: and then defeat her.^Using the mana crystals you provided
column3: I have created this Power Focus. Saragosa is a glutton. She will be unable to resist its lure. Inside it lie magics that will greatly diminish her power. Let us hope she does not see through my ruse.... Prepare yourself
column4: <name>
column5: and speak to me again when you are ready to face Saragosa.

column1: Let Nothing Go To Waste^72^All^Dragonblight^Elder Ko'nani^Elder Ko'nani^Let Nothing Go To Waste^^^Retrieve 6 Stolen Moa'ki Goods from the wolvar. Return them to Elder Ko'nani at Moa'ki Harbor.^The wolvar have always been our natural enemies. But the incursion of your peoples into the Great Dragonblight has forced them into a small space upon the glade to the north. Combined with the land's upheaval this morning
column2: they have become even more aggressive than ever before. They have made several raids upon our goods... things that we'll need if we are to survive the trek from our home here. As a sign of good faith and friendship
column3: retrieve our goods from the Snowfall Glade wolvar.

column1: Slay Loguhn^73^All^Dragonblight^Elder Ko'nani^Elder Ko'nani^Let Nothing Go To Waste^^Tua'kea's Crab Traps
column2: Signs of Big Watery Trouble
column3: Spiritual Insight^Smear the Blood of Loguhn upon yourself and then return to Elder Ko'nani at Moa'ki Harbor.^Already it goes from bad to worse. There is only one course to take... regrettably
column4: Loguhn must die! He's the alpha male of the Snowfall Glade tribe and one mean wolvar. But it's the only way to get a short break from their attacks and stealing forays. You will find the "Render of Flesh" in front of his hovel upon the northern rise of the glade. It's larger than the others and hard to miss. Kill him and smear his blood upon yourself
column5: both to show your dominance and respect.

column1: Planning for the Future^72^All^Dragonblight^Trapper Mau'i^Trapper Mau'i^^^^Collect 12 Snowfall Glade Pups. Deliver them to Trapper Mau'i at Moa'ki Harbor.^We must move decisively against the wolvar if we're to have a chance of survival. However
column2: I worry that in our zeal
column3: too many of them will be slain. The Snowfall Glade wolvar have as much right to exist as do we. You and I will see to it that they get that chance. If Elder Ko'nani hasn't asked you already
column4: he will ask you to deal with them. While you're upon the glade to the north
column5: I'd like you to bag up their pups and bring them back to me.

column1: Spirits Watch Over Us^72^All^Borean Tundra^Elder Muahit^Elder Muahit^Not Without a Fight!^^^Elder Muahit at Njord's Breath Bay wants you to find Iruk's corpse in the water and retrieve Issliruk's totem.^Powerful spirits watch over my tribe -- Kaskala will not be lost. Issliruk will give us courage
column2: Tayutka will make sure our survivors always have food and shelter and Karkut will watch over the fallen so they do not lose their way. Issliruk's guidance is the one we need the most right now. I asked my nephew
column3: Iruk
column4: to bring me Issliruk's totem
column5: but the Kvaldir's spears struck him down and his body fell into the waters to the north. Bring me the totem
column6: <name>. Don't let my nephew's death be in vain.

column1: One Last Delivery^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Gerald Green^Hilda Stoneforge^Farshire^^^Deliver the Crate of Farshire Ore to Hilda Stoneforge in Valiance Keep.^That's it then. With the last of the ore you salvaged we now have enough to send to Valiance Keep. If Farshire is wiped off the face of Azeroth
column2: then at least let us be remembered as the first ones to defend our land and the last ones to give up. Take this ore to Hilda Stoneforge - she is a good friend of mine. Tell her to make some good weapons with this ore. We'll need plenty of them in the days to come.

column1: Weapons for Farshire^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Hilda Stoneforge^Gerald Green^Farshire^^^Return to Gerald Green in Farshire.^Farshire is overrun and all that Gerald can think of is to get me my ore shipment? I swear that man has as much heart as any of our soldiers on the frontlines. We cannot let the civilians lose their lands if they're willing to fight for them. We might not have the troops to spare
column2: but we can send them weapons. These were earmarked for new recruits
column3: but I'll be able to cover those with the ore you've brought me. Send word to Gerald that weapons are on the way.

column1: Call to Arms!^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Gerald Green^Gerald Green^Farshire^^^Go to the town hall building in Farshire and ring the bell inside of it.^Farshire has a fighting chance now
column2: <name>. That's all we could've asked for and you've made it possible. All we need now is a rallying point. I'll have my men deliver the weapons to our town hall. Go and ring the town hall bell so any survivors know to rally there. It's time to show the Scourge what we're made of.

column1: Mustering the Reds^71^All^Borean Tundra^Keristrasza^Raelorasz^Keristrasza^^^Keristrasza has asked you to bring her to Raelorasz at the Transitus Shield.^Malygos is certainly aware that something is amiss. I know him. His focus is fragmented. I am confident that I can lure him from the safety of his realm when he learns what has become of his precious Saragosa. Take me to Raelorasz at once
column2: <name>. He must rouse every dragon he commands to face Malygos.

column1: The Tides Turn^71^All^Borean Tundra^Elder Muahit^Elder Muahit^Not Without a Fight!^^Travel to Moa'ki Harbor^Elder Muahit wants you to kill Heigarr the Horrible in Njord's Breath Bay.^The spirits have heard our cry for help
column2: <name>. It's a sign that Kaskala might yet be saved. Take advantage of the confusion the weather has created and slay the Kvaldir leader. Your actions will sway the battle in our favor
column3: I am sure of it.

column1: Springing the Trap^71^All^Borean Tundra^Raelorasz^Raelorasz^Keristrasza^^^Raelorasz wants you to use Raelorasz' Spark at the signal fire in Coldarra.^We owe this opportunity in great part to your efforts
column2: <name>. It is only fitting that you initiate the attack on Malygos. Take this spark and use it to light the signal fire northwest of the Nexus. Keristrasza will direct you from there.

column1: Prisoner of War^71^All^Borean Tundra^Raelorasz^Raelorasz^Keristrasza^^^Raelorasz at the Transitus Shield wants you to enter the Nexus and release Keristrasza.^Malygos has taken Keristrasza to serve as his consort!? Unthinkable! She'll never cooperate willingly
column2: but Malygos is a powerful aspect
column3: and will eventually bend her will. This cannot come to pass
column4: <name>. I refuse to allow her to suffer this indignity. You must enter the Nexus and do whatever is required to spare her this fate.

column1: A Tauren Among Taunka^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Wartook Iceborn^Emissary Brighthoof^The Fall of Taunka'le Village^^Into the Fold^Seek out Emissary Brighthoof at the Westwind Refugee Camp.^<Wartook points northeast.> She is quite kind
column2: you know. If it were not for your emissary
column3: the surviving refugees may have given up hope. While she may not be taunka by birthright
column4: the tribe has taken to her as a village elder for the time being. If you are who I think you are
column5: please go and pay Emissary Brighthoof a visit inside the refugee camp. She has been waiting for you.

column1: Into the Fold^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Emissary Brighthoof^Emissary Brighthoof^The Fall of Taunka'le Village^^^Emissary Brighthoof at the Westwind Refugee Camp in the Dragonblight wants you to recover 10 Horde Armaments.^Before we can officially bring these taunka into the Horde we must recover our armaments from the Anub'ar Nerubians that infest the nearby woods. The armaments were lost when a caravan from Agmar's Hammer was ambushed by the Scourge late last night. Venture out into the woods to the east of Westwind Refugee Camp and recover those armaments
column2: <race>.

column1: The Taunka and the Tauren^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Senior Sergeant Juktok^Emissary Brighthoof^The Taunka and the Tauren^^Into the Fold^Seek out Emissary Brighthoof at the Westwind Refugee Camp.^The Scourge have seized control of the capital city of the taunka
column2: Icemist Village! All living taunka that escaped the massacre are being held in protective custody at the Westwind Refugee Camp on the western border of Dragonblight. Lord Hellscream believes that the taunka must join the Horde if they are to survive and has sent a tauren emissary to Westwind to bolster our relationship with the winter tauren. Travel to Westwind Refugee Camp and seek out Emissary Brighthoof. You will assist her.

column1: Pride of the Horde^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Blood Guard Roh'kill^Blood Guard Roh'kill^^^^Blood Guard Roh'kill at the Westwind Refugee Camp in the Dragonblight wants you to slay 15 Anub'ar Ambushers.^I was one of the guards chosen to escort the caravan carrying the armament shipment to this camp. The attack came fast and without warning. We fought and killed dozens of the beasts
column2: but in the end there were simply too many. Tor'zin and I barely made it out alive... If not for our injuries we would be out in the woods hunting down those fiends ourselves. Will you help us regain our lost pride? Search the woods east of here for Anub'ar Nerubians and kill them! For the Horde!

column1: Find Kurun!^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Fallen Earthen Warrior^Kurun^Find Kurun!^^Raining Down Destruction^Speak with Kurun on the hill overlooking Thor Modan.^The Earthen warrior's stone surface is covered with cracks and gouges. Although it is incapable of bleeding
column2: you can sense that the warrior is near death. A low
column3: hoarse voice escapes from the dying warrior's mouth. "Find... Kurun... you must find... Kurun." It looks at you helplessly as you ask for any clues as to who or what Kurun might be. "Our... leader... he stands on the... hill overlooking Thor Modan... commands us. Please... tell him... we cannot take... the city... "

column1: Raining Down Destruction^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Kurun^Kurun^Find Kurun!^^^Kurun on the hill overlooking Thor Modan wants you to disrupt the iron dwarves' work by throwing boulders into the exposed area of Thor Modan.^Beneath us is iron's ancient bastion
column2: Thor Modan. Thousands of years ago
column3: the stone giants tore the land asunder
column4: collapsing part of the city and exposing much of the rest. Even now
column5: the iron dwarves attempt to reclaim their old capital
column6: but we will not permit it. My giants fill the trench with boulders and debris
column7: hoping to seal it off and kill the servants of iron as they work. Take up the boulders you see near the trench to the northeast
column8: and help us put an end to their efforts.

column1: Blood Oath of the Horde^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Emissary Brighthoof^Emissary Brighthoof^The Fall of Taunka'le Village^^^Speak to the taunka at Westwind Refugee Camp and make 5 of them pledge their allegiance to the Horde.^They are ready
column2: <name>. These taunka will all willingly join the Horde and give all that they have to see the Scourge driven from this world. <Brighthoof hands you a scroll bearing the insignia of the Horde.> Within this scroll you will find the blood oath of the Horde. Tradition dictates that our new taunka brothers and sisters utter the sacred words herein. Take the scroll and swear the taunka into the Horde
column3: commander. Return the scroll to me when you have completed your duty.

column1: Filling the Cages^74^All^Grizzly Hills^Samir^Samir^Good Troll Hunting^^^Samir at Granite Springs wants you to use the Bounty Hunter's Cage on a drakkari troll that's been stunned by Budd.^Ol Budd's seen better days. Ever since our stay in Ghostlands he's been useless to us. We've had to find ways to make it on our own
column2: and today that means sellin' trolls to the highest bidder. Fortunately
column3: we've recently found a use for Budd. Something about his condition allows him to mingle with the local trolls
column4: so we taught him a little game that's turned us a tidy profit. See for yourself. Talk to Budd
column5: take him southwest to Drak' Zin Ruins and use this cage as soon as he tags a troll.

column1: Into the Breach^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Kurun^Kurun^Find Kurun!^^^Kurun on the hill overlooking Thor Modan wants you to kill Iron Thane Argrum.^If we can't overcome the defenders inside Thor Modan
column2: the iron dwarves can hold out forever. The Earthen are bravely taking on the constructs built by the sons of iron
column3: but they cannot break into the city. The tunnels narrow too quickly for my fellow giants to be of use
column4: so our options are few. Would you be willing to venture into the city and kill the dwarf commanding the resistance?

column1: The Damaged Journal^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Battered Journal^Torthen Deepdig^^^The Runic Keystone^Recover 8 Missing Journal Pages
column2: combine them with the Incomplete Journal
column3: and return the completed journal to Torthen Deepdig at the Westfall Brigade Encampment.^This battered
column4: mud-stained journal has seen better days. Leafing through the pages
column5: you discover dozens of notes
column6: diagrams
column7: and maps. The author's handwriting seems vaguely familiar
column8: but you're unable to place it until you discover an entry signed with the name of Brann Bronzebeard. The back half of the book
column9: containing the most recent entries
column10: has been torn away. Pages litter the battlefield
column11: and it will be impossible to know what Brann discovered here until the book is whole again.

column1: The Runic Keystone^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Torthen Deepdig^Torthen Deepdig^^The Damaged Journal^The Runic Prophecies^Bring 5 Runic Keystone Fragments to Torthen Deepdig at the Westfall Brigade Encampment.^Brann's journal mentions that he used a runic keystone to illuminate the important runes on the plate he discovered. Without the keystone
column2: the plate's contents would be little better than gibberish. At the end of Brann's last entry
column3: he describes the iron dwarf defenders seizing the keystone from him
column4: shattering it
column5: and dividing it among themselves. Before we can decipher the runed plate
column6: we must hunt down the fragments. Any of the dwarves within Thor Modan or the buildings around it may carry fragments.

column1: Truce?^73^All^Grizzly Hills^Drakuru^Drakuru^Good Troll Hunting^^^Drakuru at Granite Springs wants you to use the Dull Carving Knife near his cage and then speak to him.^Watch yerself
column2: mon. Drakuru shrunk more <race> heads than I can remember - and even if I could remember
column3: I couldn't count that high. Lucky for you I be stuck in dis cage or I'd be addin' one more to da list. But things bein' what they are
column4: mebbe we be puttin' our differences aside fer a time
column5: eh? Drakuru know things
column6: mon. Things that will aid you in your struggle here. <Drakuru cuts the palm of his hand on one of his tusks and extends it through the cage.> So
column7: what you say
column8: mon... truce?

column1: Vial of Visions^74^All^Grizzly Hills^Drakuru^Drakuru^Good Troll Hunting^^Scourgekabob^Drakuru at Granite Springs wants you to bring him an Imbued Vial
column2: a Waterweed Frond
column3: and 3 Haze Leaves.^First things first
column4: mon. There be some preparatory work that need doin'. No tellin' how long dey gunna keep me here. Ya be needin' a powerful elixir so we can be keepin' in touch. Lucky for you
column5: I know just the thing! And the ingredients all be close by. I need a vial from the pretty little troll over there
column6: some waterweed from the lake just north of here
column7: and a few haze leaves found around the camp here. Hurry now
column8: mon
column9: before dey be haulin' me away.

column1: Subject to Interpretation^74^All^Grizzly Hills^Drakuru^Image of Drakuru^Good Troll Hunting^^^Drakuru wants you to get 5 Frozen Mojo from the Drakkari Trolls at the Ruins of Drak'Zin and then use the elixir at Drakuru's Brazier there.^A legendary set of artifacts
column2: lost for thousands of years
column3: were created to make Drak'Tharon Keep impervious. Most think they be myth
column4: but Drakuru knows better
column5: mon! I nearly discovered where one be
column6: but got captured while interpreting hieroglyphs. Ya gotta summon my soul back dere so I can finish readin' em! Use my elixir at da brazier on Drak'Zin Ruins
column7: southwest of here. You'll hafta mix in da frozen mojo my bruddas be holdin'. I hate ta see my bruddas fall
column8: but it be for the greater good.

column1: The Runic Prophecies^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Torthen Deepdig^Torthen Deepdig^^The Runic Keystone^The Captive Prospectors^Torthen Deepdig at the Westfall Brigade Encampment wants you to decipher the three Rune Plates.^We've no time to lose! Now that we've reassembled the runic keystone -- well
column2: most of it -- we can decipher the contents of those very same runic plates Brann was working on before he fled. We have no way of knowing if he managed to read the contents of all three plates
column3: but we'll have to assume he got enough information to determine his next destination. Stand before each of the plates and use the keystone to determine the contents of each. Brann may be counting on us!

column1: Your Presence is Required at Stars' Rest^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Emissary Skyhaven^Image of Archmage Modera^Your Presence is Required at Stars' Rest^^^Speak with the Image of Archmage Modera at Stars' Rest.^<class>
column2: I know these tuskarr will ask you to do many favors for them
column3: but you must get to Stars' Rest with all due haste! The upheaval in the land this morning is sure to have broader repercussions than just inconveniencing the natives. Stars' Rest is westward past the intersection of the road leading north out of the harbor. There is an archmage there named Modera. She will be expecting you.

column1: Your Presence is Required at Agmar's Hammer^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Envoy Ripfang^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^Your Presence is Required at Agmar's Hammer^^^Speak with the Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver at Agmar's Hammer.^<class>
column2: I know these tuskarr will ask you to do many favors for them
column3: but you must get to Agmar's Hammer with all due haste! The upheaval in the land this morning is sure to have broader repercussions than just inconveniencing the natives. The Hammer is westward past the intersection of the road leading north out of the harbor. Archmage Aethas Sunreaver himself will be expecting you!

column1: Softening the Blow^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Captain Gryan Stoutmantle^Brugar Stoneshear^Softening the Blow^^^Bring Brugar Stoneshear at the Westfall Brigade Encampment a cask of Howlin' Good Moonshine.^Our best bet for moving our forces quickly to Icecrown Glacier lies with the network of tunnels beneath the ancient iron dwarf city of Thor Modan. Brugar Stoneshear and his Explorers' League boys aren't going to be happy
column2: but orders are orders. The news might go over better if you brought him a cask of that moonshine sold by that trapper
column3: Hugh Glass
column4: down at Redwood Trading Post
column5: southeast of here along the tree line. Man's not right in the head
column6: but you won't find better moonshine out here.

column1: Rifle the Bodies^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^Your Presence is Required at Agmar's Ham^^^Find the Moonrest Gardens Plans and return them to the Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver at Agmar's Hammer.^The Moonrest Gardens to the southwest were the final resting place of a group of Highborne elves. It was also a ley line nexus. The blue dragonflight used a magical device they call a surge needle to destroy that nexus
column2: freeing the power to redirect at their will. I want more information and you are going to get it for me! After the land was destroyed at the ruins
column3: the ghosts of the Highborne rose up and decimated half of the mage hunters there. Go rifle their corpses for clues.

column1: Rifle the Bodies^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Image of Archmage Modera^Image of Archmage Modera^Your Presence is Required at Stars' Rest^^^Find the Moonrest Gardens Plans and return them to the Image of Archmage Modera at Stars' Rest.^The Moonrest Gardens to the southwest were the final resting place of a noble group of Highborne elves. It was also a powerful ley line nexus. The blue dragonflight used a magical device they call a surge needle to destroy that nexus
column2: freeing the power to redirect at their will. I need more information and I hope that you will get it for me. After the upheaval at the ruins
column3: the ghosts of the Highborne rose up and decimated half of the mage hunters present. Go rifle their corpses for clues.

column1: Brothers in Battle^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Brugar Stoneshear^Brugar Stoneshear^Softening the Blow^^^Kill 10 Runic Battle Golems and return to Brugar Stoneshear at the Westfall Brigade Encampment.^I hope Gryan knows I withdrew my men from Thor Modan when the battle began. There's no way we can excavate anything until that place settles down. You seem like a brave sort
column2: though
column3: and you have Stoutmantle's trust. Thor Modan is just to the northeast of us and the battle still rages between our Earthen brothers and the creations of those accursed iron dwarves. Help our brethren to even the odds and I'll start figuring out how we're going to accomplish this survey of Thor Modan.

column1: Uncovering the Tunnels^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Brugar Stoneshear^Brugar Stoneshear^Softening the Blow^^^Brugar Stoneshear at the Westfall Brigade Encampment wants you to explore the North Building
column2: the East Building
column3: and the South Building of Thor Modan.^The first place we'll search for entrances to the Thor Modan tunnel system will be the outlying buildings. As I left the site with my men
column4: it looked like the iron dwarf defenders were taking refuge inside the buildings. Be careful as you explore them. Any tunnel entrances are likely to be toward the back of the buildings. I'm not sure what Stoutmantle thinks we're going to find down there
column5: but I doubt the iron dwarves will make the search easy.

column1: Prevent the Accord^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Image of Archmage Modera^Image of Archmage Modera^Your Presence is Required at Stars' Rest^^^Deliver Wind Trader Mu'fah's Remains and the Scales of Goramosh to the Image of Archmage Modera at Stars' Rest.^We need to kill two birds with one stone here
column2: <class>. You're the stone. Our two birds are Wind Trader Mu'fah and Goramosh. They should be somewhere in the western half of the Moonrest Gardens. Most likely they're in the larger two-story building overlooking the pit. I require proof of their demise
column3: if you would be so kind.

column1: Prevent the Accord^73^Horde^Dragonblight^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^Your Presence is Required at Agmar's Ham^^^Deliver Wind Trader Mu'fah's Remains and the Scales of Goramosh to the Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver at Agmar's Hammer.^We need to kill two birds with one stone here
column2: <class>. You're the stone. Our two birds are Wind Trader Mu'fah and Goramosh. They should be somewhere in the western half of the Moonrest Gardens. Most likely they're in the larger two-story building overlooking the pit. I require proof of their demise
column3: if you would be so kind.

column1: Avenge this Atrocity!^72^All^Dragonblight^Ethenial Moonshadow^Ethenial Moonshadow^Avenge this Atrocity!^^^Kill any combination of 15 Dragonblight Mage Hunters
column2: Moonrest Stalkers
column3: Surge Needle Sorcerers
column4: and Focus Wizards. After you have done that
column5: return to Ethenial Moonshadow at Moonrest Gardens.^These so-called mage hunters came here and destroyed our resting place. Avenge us
column6: or I will see to it that your base of operations is overrun with the spirits of the dead!

column1: Sacrifices Must be Made^74^All^Grizzly Hills^Image of Drakuru^Image of Drakuru^Good Troll Hunting^^^Drakuru wants you to bring the Eye of the Prophets to him at Drakuru's Brazier in Zeb'Halak.^I've got it
column2: mon! To da north
column3: on da Ziggurat at Zeb'Halak be a stone head with ruby eyes. One o' dem be da Eye of the Prophets! Bring it to the brazier there and drink my elixir. Again
column4: ya be needing some mojo for my elixir to work - dis time from da warlord
column5: Zim'bo. He be hidin' in one of da huts in Zeb'Halak. It be a shame to kill Zim'bo
column6: mon
column7: but he swore da blood oath to defend Drak'Tharon and he done failed. Now at least his mojo be helpin' us to reclaim Drak'Tharon.

column1: Agmar's Hammer^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Emissary Brighthoof^Overlord Agmar^The Fall of Taunka'le Village^^Victory Nears...
column2: Black Blood of Yogg-Saron
column3: Marked for Death: High Cultist Zangus
column4: Containing the Rot
column5: The Kor'kron Vanguard!^Travel to Agmar's Hammer in the Dragonblight and speak to Overlord Agmar.^Directly east of this refugee camp stands Agmar's Hammer - testament to the Hordes' power in the Dragonblight. While I have no doubt that our Horde brothers and sisters are already seeing the result of your efforts to bring the taunka into the Horde
column6: I want you to deliver news of your success to Overlord Agmar in person. Go now
column7: <name>! Race the winds! East to Agmar's Hammer!

column1: Tua'kea's Crab Traps^72^All^Dragonblight^Tua'kea^Tua'kea^^Slay Loguhn^^Collect 8 of Tua'kea's Crab Traps and return them to him at Moa'ki Harbor.^With all of the troubles
column2: I've lost my assistants. I was wondering if maybe you could help me? I have many crab traps under the waves of the harbor. Will you retrieve them for me? I'm too old for that sort of thing and the waters can be very dangerous. Please
column3: take this bladder. It will help you to breathe while you're down there.

column1: The Fate of Orlond^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Brugar Stoneshear^Surveyor Orlond^Softening the Blow^^^Locate Surveyor Orlond within Thor Modan.^When we began excavating the city
column2: I sent Surveyor Orlond to check the stability of the tunnels in Thor Modan. I didn't see him escape when we withdrew at the beginning of the battle
column3: and I worry he may still be trapped inside the city. If we're going to get an army through Thor Modan
column4: we'll need the information he was collecting. Stoutmantle and his superiors would have my hide if the tunnels collapsed on one of their brigades!

column1: Signs of Big Watery Trouble^72^All^Dragonblight^Wrecked Crab Trap^Tua'kea^Signs of Big Watery Trouble^Slay Loguhn^^Inform Tua'kea at Moa'ki Harbor about the wrecked crab trap.^This crab trap appears to have been destroyed by something much larger than the nearby circling sharks. Perhaps Tua'kea
column2: the fisherman at Moa'ki Harbor
column3: should be told about this?

column1: End Arcanimus^73^All^Dragonblight^Ethenial Moonshadow^Ethenial Moonshadow^Avenge this Atrocity!^^^Destroy Arcanimus and then return to Ethenial Moonshadow at Moonrest Gardens.^There is one last thing that I would have you do
column2: <name> the <race>. I would have you destroy Arcanimus! The sorcerers to the west used that giant device in the sky to bore a massive pit into our resting place. When they did that
column3: they unleashed a monstrosity! I would not care if it were only a concern for mortals
column4: but Arcanimus feeds upon the spirits of the dead. You will put an end to it now!

column1: Steady as a Rock?^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Surveyor Orlond^Brugar Stoneshear^Softening the Blow^^Check Up on Raegar^Retreive the Portable Seismograph and use it to take stability readings in Thor Modan
column2: then return to Brugar Stoneshear at the Westfall Brigade Encampment.^Orlond's notes indicate that he brought a piece of equipment called a portable seismograph with him
column3: but the device is nowhere to be seen. The survey log shows that Orlond completed all his readings in the Thor Modan tunnel
column4: save one labeled the 'east end of the exposed tunnel.' The last entry in the log indicates Orlond tried to take refuge in the water and was attacked by subterranean threshers. They might've taken his equipment.You'll need to recover it before you can take the last reading.

column1: The Bait^72^All^Dragonblight^Tua'kea^Tua'kea^Signs of Big Watery Trouble^^^Obtain The Flesh of "Two Huge Pincers" and deliver it to Tua'kea at Moa'ki Harbor.^I'm sure of it... our ancient aquatic nemesis
column2: Tu'u'gwar
column3: "He Who Plays With Food"
column4: has returned. We must lay a trap for him
column5: you and I. If Tu'u'gwar has one weakness it's his stomach. There's one meat for certain that he'd never be able to pass up. "Two Huge Pincers"
column6: the mother of all crabs
column7: Kili'ua
column8: paces upon her island out in the waters to the southwest. You must pay her a visit and return with her meat.

column1: Meat on the Hook^73^All^Dragonblight^Tua'kea^Tua'kea^Signs of Big Watery Trouble^^^Slay Tu'u'gwar and then return to Tua'kea at Moa'ki Harbor.^The time has come my friend: Tu'u'gwar must be dealt with! I've prepped the meat so that the beast is sure to come once you bait the hook I have out in the water. Just follow the fishing line here down to it. Whatever you do
column2: don't let Tu'u'gwar swallow you whole
column3: <name>!

column1: Last Rites^72^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Thassarian^Thassarian^Finding the Phylactery^^^Go to the Temple City of En'kilah and find the teleportation orb beneath the floating Scourge citadel of Naxxanar. Use it to reach the top and help Thassarian there.^I served Arthas in death
column2: because I had no choice. He had control over my will and my body. The Cult of the Damned serves Arthas in life... willingly. Now that we know the words of power to enter Naxxanar we can put an end to the cultist blight. Go to En'kilah and look for the teleportation orb beneath the floating citadel. Work your way up and meet me at the top. Arm yourself with what courage you can
column3: we might not make it out of this alive.

column1: The Damaged Journal^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Battered Journal^Sage Paluna^The Damaged Journal^^^Recover 8 Missing Journal Pages
column2: combine them with the Incomplete Journal
column3: and return the completed journal to Sage Paluna at Camp Oneqwah.^This battered
column4: mud-stained journal has seen better days. Leafing through the pages
column5: you discover dozens of notes
column6: diagrams
column7: and maps in the dwarven language. The only text you're able to decipher is the name of Brann Bronzebeard scrawled at the end of one of the entries. The back half of the book
column8: containing the most recent entries
column9: has been torn away. Someone thought the notes important enough to attempt to destroy them. Perhaps gathering the missing pages from the battlefield will yield some clues.

column1: Mr. Floppy's Perilous Adventure^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Emily^Squire Walter^^^^Help Emily and Mr. Floppy get back to the Westfall Brigade Encampment
column2: then speak to Squire Walter.^Excuse me
column3: <Mister/Ma'am>
column4: do you know the way back to the soldiers' camp? Mr. Floppy and I decided to go for a walk in the woods
column5: and my brother Walter was gonna come with us
column6: but then he had squire things to do. So Mr. Floppy and I went by ourselves
column7: but we got lost
column8: and there were a whole bunch of hungry wolves
column9: but we found this tower. The wolves went away
column10: but we're still lost. I asked Mr. Floppy
column11: and he doesn't know the way back. Would you help us? Please?

column1: Spiritual Insight^72^All^Dragonblight^Toalu'u the Mystic^Toalu'u the Mystic^Spiritual Insight^Slay Loguhn^^Speak with Toalu'u the Mystic at Moa'ki Harbor after you have attained your spiritual insight.^<race>
column2: we have not heard from our people at Indu'le Village since the ground shook and was torn apart! Have you ever been upon a vision quest? You've bested Loguhn
