column3: so you must be capable. I will give you a special incense to sprinkle into my brazier. Breathe deep from its vapors and your spirit will be sent aloft to view what has transpired at Indu'le. As your spirit soars
column4: I will be able to look through your eyes.

column1: Seared Scourge^74^All^Grizzly Hills^Mack Fearsen^Mack Fearsen^Seared Scourge^Scourgekabob^^Mack at Granite Springs wants you to use his grog to burn 20 Famished Scourge Trolls at Drak'Tharon.^... gotta burn these corpshes 'fore they shtart walkin' around again. Poppa always said
column2: only thing worshe than havin' to kill a troll is havin' ta kill a troll twice. Say
column3: ... shpeakin' of Scourge
column4: we can't get into tha' troll keep up north 'til we get them trolls thinned out a bit. How 'bout ya take shome o my grog here and put them bashtards outta their misery?

column1: Elder Mana'loa^72^All^Dragonblight^Toalu'u the Mystic^Elder Mana'loa^Spiritual Insight^^^Speak with the statue
column2: Elder Mana'loa
column3: at Indu'le Village.^My people.... <The mystic is on the verge of breaking down.> While your spirit was flying through the village
column4: I sensed that Elder Mana'loa took notice of you. <name>
column5: he wishes to speak with you. The stone elders are revered by us as fonts of ancient wisdom. The elder must want to help. Seek him in the northwest corner of the village.

column1: Freedom for the Lingering^72^All^Dragonblight^Elder Mana'loa^Elder Mana'loa^Spiritual Insight^^^Put to rest any combination of 15 Indu'le Fishermen
column2: Mystics and Warriors
column3: then return to Elder Mana'loa at Indu'le Village.^The sacred ground of the elves to the west has been torn asunder. Now their magic is moving through the land causing ruin where it flows. The souls of the Kalu'ak are in danger as the blue dragons forces attempt to control the magic. The power came up through the lake
column4: instantly slaying most in the village. Those that survived were driven insane. <name>
column5: you must release these spirits so that they may move on. Leave the deranged living alone; they may yet regain their sanity in time.

column1: Conversing With the Depths^72^All^Dragonblight^Elder Mana'loa^Toalu'u the Mystic^Spiritual Insight^^^Commune with The Pearl of the Depths and do as the sea-goddess Oacha'noa instructs.^The watery goddess
column2: Oacha'noa
column3: must be consulted; only she will know what the destiny of the Kalu'ak is to be. And only The Pearl of the Depths can call her forth from the murky nether. Off the coast to the southwest rises The Briny Pinnacle. Atop it sits the altar upon which the pearl rests. Commune at the altar and Oacha'noa is certain to hear your call. Do as she says lest you incur her wrath and bring ruin upon all of the tuskarr. Should you survive
column4: return to the mystic.

column1: Message from the West^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Messenger Torvus^Messenger Torvus^^Hellscream's Champion^^Read the Letter from Saurfang and then destroy it.^<Torvus shakes your hand
column2: giving you a letter in the process.> <Torvus speaks under his breath.> Just play along
column3: <name>. It is good to see you here
column4: soldier! Lord Hellscream has undoubtedly sent his strongest warriors to Lord Agmar! <Torvus speaks under his breath.> Read it and then destroy it in the fire pot next to me.

column1: Victory Nears...^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Overlord Agmar^Senior Sergeant Juktok^Victory Nears...^Agmar's Hammer^^Speak to Senior Sergeant Juktok at Agmar's Hammer.^There remain only two primary threats that stand in our way. One is the dread citadel of Naxxramas
column2: far to the east
column3: above the Alliance fortress of Wintergarde and the other is the Pit of Narjun
column4: exit point for the undead armies of Azjol'Nerub. It is from the Pit of Narjun that the Anub'ar Nerubians assaulted and ultimately razed the taunka village of Icemist. We will destroy the Anub'ar and close off the Pit of Narjun. Report to Senior Sergeant Juktok for your mission orders.

column1: Repurposed Technology^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Jeremiah Hawning^Jeremiah Hawning^Reference Material^^^Jeremiah Hawning at Farshire wants you to destroy 5 Harvest Collectors and then use Jeremiah's Tools to rewire them.^Ok
column2: I've got it! The rewiring is a little complicated
column3: but nothing a clever <class> like you can't handle. Take my tools and put some of the harvest collectors out of commission. Once they're down use the tools to plug all the red wires into the blue sockets. That'll make them go into self-defense mode. Hurry
column4: <name>. Before long there won't be anything left to save.

column1: From the Depths of Azjol-Nerub^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Senior Sergeant Juktok^Senior Sergeant Juktok^Victory Nears...^^Strength of Icemist^Explore the Pit of Narjun and return with your findings to Senior Sergeant Juktok at Agmar's Hammer.^The undead Nerubians that attacked Icemist Village came from a gigantic sinkhole known as the Pit of Narjun. If left alone
column2: those fiends will no doubt flank our forces at the Wrathgate and end our march to victory. I need eyes on the ground
column3: <name>. You are to head west and investigate the Pit of Narjun. We need to locate their primary exit point and seal it off! Find me that location.

column1: Search and Rescue^74^All^Drak'Tharon Keep^Mack Fearsen^Kurzel^Seared Scourge^^^Mack at Granite Springs wants you to go into Drak'Tharon and find out what became of Kurzel.^Orc women... they just don't lissen - hic. Know what I mean
column2: <race>? Kurzel's been with us fer years. You'd think she'd get a feel fer how we do things by now. Lure the fools in fer the dangerous work
column3: then reap the rewards when it's safe. What's so hard to understand? Not her though... impatient green-skin goes off and takes matters into her own hands. Probably dead by now
column4: but I'd feel horrible if we didn't follow after her
column5: and I'm in no shape to do it myself - hic. So whatdya say
column6: pal?

column1: Seared Scourge^72^All^Grizzly Hills^Mack Fearsen^Mack Fearsen^^^^Mack at Granite Springs wants you to use his grog to burn 30 Famished Scourge Trolls.^Whatcha waitin' fer
column2: <class>? Them shcourged trolls ain't gunna kill themselves! You know the drill. Git up ta Drak'Tharon up north... Take some o thish here grog and hurl it at 'em from a distance.... Then jusht sit back an' watch 'em burn.

column1: Black Blood of Yogg-Saron^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Borus Ironbender^Borus Ironbender^Black Blood of Yogg-Saron^Agmar's Hammer^^Borus Ironbender at Agmar's Hammer in the Dragonblight wants you to recover 10 Black Blood of Yogg-Saron Samples.^Angrathar
column2: the Wrathgate... I watched as the metal holding the gate together pulsed and undulated as if it were alive! In 50 years I've never seen metal "breathe." Only ones who knew anything about it were the tuskarr. They called it the "Black Blood of Yogg-Saron" and told me to keep my distance. There's a sinkhole outside Icemist Village to the west called the Pit of Narjun. I've heard of these sinkholes being rich with this strange ore. If you head that way
column3: could you try and get me some samples?

column1: An Enemy in Arthas^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Kilix the Unraveler^Kilix the Unraveler^An Enemy in Arthas^^^Kilix the Unraveler at the Pit of Narjun in the Dragonblight has asked that you slay 6 Anub'ar Underlords.^We are in the midst of a civil war. At the heart of this world the last living members of my species defend themselves against total annihilation. The Lich King seeks to rule the kingdom of Azjol-Nerub at any cost. Those that do not acquiesce are branded enemies of the Scourge and marked for death. In Arthas we both have an enemy... Join our cause and rid this place of the taint of Anub'ar! Let Anub'arak himself hear the anguish of their death cries!

The Lost Empire^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Kilix the Unraveler^Overlord Agmar^An Enemy in Arthas^^^Deliver Kilix's Battle Plan to Overlord Agmar at Agmar's Hammer to the east.^You have proven that you are willing to assist the Azjol Empire in its time of need and as such the Azjol Empire will assist the Horde. Take this scroll back to your leader. It documents the strengths and weaknesses of the Nerubians attacking Icemist Village. Consider it a gesture of good faith - a willingness to help your people. Use the knowledge on those pages to crush the Anub'ar and you will have done a service for us all. Farewell
column2: <race>.

column1: Heart of the Ancients^74^All^Grizzly Hills^Image of Drakuru^Heart of the Ancients^Good Troll Hunting^^^Drakuru wants you to go to the uppermost chamber at Blue Sky Logging Ground and find the Heart of the Ancients.^Secrets of da ages
column2: be revealed to me now! <Drakuru peers through the Eye of the Prophets.> Ahh
column3: great be mah destiny
column4: <name>. You be lucky ta know me.... There! I be seein' it
column5: mon. The Heart of the Ancients. Dis be too easy! You gunna find da heart lyin' near da corpse of a goblin east of here. He be up in a chamber
column6: near a river of broken trees. Hurry
column7: mon
column8: before someone else be findin' it!

column1: Nozzlerust Defense^74^All^Dragonblight^Narf^Narf^^^^Kill 12 Wastes Diggers and 1 Wastes Taskmaster at the digs surrounding Galakrond's Rest. Return to Narf at Nozzlerust Post when the task is complete.^You
column2: <class>! These undead south of us are being a constant nuisance to our work. Go clear them out
column3: will ya?

column1: Stocking Up^74^All^Dragonblight^Xink^Xink^Return to Sender^^^Gather 8 bundles of Composite Ore from the digs surrounding Galakrond's Rest and bring them to Xink at Nozzlerust Post.^Hello hello! The Scourge to the south are digging up some ancient dragon thing. I could care less why they're doing it
column2: but they're pulling cartloads of composite ore in the process. Go lift me a bunch of that ore. That stuff should yield a pretty penny for all the weapons the Horde are crafting.

column1: Shaved Ice^74^All^Dragonblight^Zivlix^Zivlix^Shaved Ice^^^Collect 4 Ice Shard Clusters from Ice Elementals in the north and bring them to Zivlix at Nozzlerust Post.^I've never seen you before... are you new to the Vice? Glad to have you. I could always use some more hands. You get the materials
column2: I'll finish my machine
column3: then we can sell it to those commander types and all go home rich. I actually have most of the primary components
column4: so I just need some of the materials for the weapon itself. Narf said that jagged ice shards from those elementals to the north would make perfect shrapnel for my bombs - go nab some
column5: will ya?

column1: Soft Packaging^74^All^Dragonblight^Zivlix^Zivlix^Shaved Ice^^^Collect 12 Thin Animal Hides from the Jormungar Tunnelers or the Dragonbone Condors near Nozzlerust Post. Once you've located the hides
column2: return them to Zivlix.^I need some new packaging for the shrapnel bombs. All the stuff I have is too hard and the shrapnel doesn't spread when it bursts. What we need is some really thin animal hide. Those jormungar tunnelers to the west might work... or perhaps the condors sifting through the dragon bones. Go get me whatever you can find.

column1: Something That Doesn't Melt^74^All^Dragonblight^Zivlix^Zivlix^Shaved Ice^^^Search the dragon bones east of Nozzlerust Post for 12 Splintered Bone Chunks.^No no no! Those ice shards didn't work at all! They'll melt before they even do any damage. That's the last time I'll trust Narf's word on materials. This means we need something else entirely for the shrapnel. I know! I'm brilliant. Bone splinters. There are some bones all around here that the jormungar have been gnawing on pretty thoroughly. Go check them out and see if you can find me some splintered bone that I can use.

Scourge Armaments^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Borus Ironbender^Borus Ironbender^Black Blood of Yogg-Saron^^^Borus Ironbender at Agmar's Hammer in the Dragonblight wants you to bring him 8 Scourge Armaments.^I can't make a damned thing out of this ore. It simply will not hold together! Despite my best efforts the Scourge metal will not bend! Perhaps if I had some samples of some forged Scourge armaments I might be able to reverse engineer the process by which the items are created. Icemist Village is crawling with armored Scourge Nerubians. Go there and get me some Scourge armaments! With your help I might actually succeed in creating something from this ore. You'll find Icemist to the west.
Hard to Swallow^74^All^Dragonblight^Xink^Xink^^^^Battle a Hulking Jormungar east of Nozzlerust Post until it opens its mouth
column2: then throw a Potent Explosive Charge into its throat. After it explodes
column3: collect 6 slabs of Seared Jormungar Meat off of the ground and bring them back to Xink.^Those troops are sure to be needin' a hefty supply of food in their bellies. I'll let you in on a little secret that a squeamish <race> like you would never know... those jormungar worms taste just like chicken. Go provoke one of those giant hulking jormungar to the east. You're not likely to be able to kill one straight out
column4: so just toss this down its throat when it opens its mouth wide. Bring me back as many of the slabs of meat as you can tote.

column1: Lumber Hack^74^All^Dragonblight^Xink^Xink^^^^Use Xink's Shredder Control Device to call a Shredder once you reach the Harpy Nesting Grounds in the North. Gather 50 Bundles of Lumber from the trees in the area
column2: and then return to Xink at Nozzlerust Post.^Next up
column3: we need to haul in some lumber for all the towers the Alliance are building. There are some thin trees to the south
column4: but the trees the Harpies are nesting in to the north look much more fit for structures. Take this. When you get to the Harpy nesting area
column5: use the control and one of my Shredders should come to you. Gather as much lumber as it can carry. The Harpies are sure to disagree with you chopping down their homes - just deal with them as necessary. Hop to it!

column1: Harp on This!^74^All^Dragonblight^Narf^Narf^^^^Kill the Mistress of the Coldwind and 15 Coldwind harpies in the mountains northwest of Nozzlerust Post. Return to Narf once the task is complete.^<class>
column2: did you see that? That's the harpy that's been leading the attack on our shipments to the gate! I've seen her in the back of Coldwind Heights before.  Those harpies have slowed our profits long enough! Kill them all.

column1: The Might of the Horde^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Senior Sergeant Juktok^Senior Sergeant Juktok^Victory Nears...^^^Senior Sergeant Juktok at Agmar's Hammer in the Dragonblight wants you to use the Warsong Battle Standard at Icemist Village and defend it against attackers.^The taunka are now our brothers in arms. We must show our solidarity and retake Icemist Village. You will find Icemist Village west of Agmar's Hammer
column2: sitting at the foot of the mountains. Travel there and challenge the Anub'ar Nerubians! Plant our beloved Horde banner at Icemist Village and destroy all that dare come to tear it down! Let the Anub'ar feel the true might of the Horde! Let our battle standard be the last thing that they see before death!

column1: Deciphering the Journal^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Sage Paluna^Sage Paluna^The Damaged Journal^^The Runic Prophecies
column2: Pounding the Iron^Bring a sprig of Spiritsbreath to Sage Paluna at Camp Oneqwah.^Vor'takh is right -- we cannot allow this opportunity to slip through our fingers. Fortunately
column3: I think I know of a way to translate the journal of this Brann. The shamans of the Redfang furbolgs
column4: who congregate at the Heart's Blood Shrine south of the camp
column5: grow an herb known as spiritsbreath. An experienced mystic can use incense made from it to seek wisdom from the spirits of the ancestors. Seek out the shaman known as Grumbald One-Eye. He should carry the herb for his devotions to Ursoc.

column1: A Strange Device^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Goramosh's Strange Device^Image of Archmage Modera^A Strange Device^^^Deliver Goramosh's Strange Device to the Image of Archmage Modera at Stars' Rest.^Picking up this strange device
column2: you are certain that it is magical in nature. Unfortunately
column3: it doesn't seem to connote any other kind of use. Perhaps the archmage back at Stars' Rest to the east of the Moonrest Gardens would be able to tell what it's used for?

column1: Marked for Death: High Cultist Zangus^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Captain Gort^Captain Gort^^Agmar's Hammer^^Kill High Cultist Zangus and return High Cultist Zangus's Head to Captain Gort at Agmar's Hammer in the Dragonblight.^I witnessed his treachery with my own eyes! The traitor led an Anub'ar assault on this stronghold
column2: taking out some of my best soldiers. <Gort shakes his head.> He'd been working with the Scourge the whole time and we didn't have a clue! How many more like Zangus are there? We'll find 'em all and when we do... <Gort makes a cutting motion across his neck.> First on the list is Zangus. Our scouts report that he is hiding in The Pit of Narjun
column3: west of here. Find him
column4: kill him
column5: bring me his head.

column1: The Flesh-Bound Tome^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Flesh-bound Tome^Captain Gort^The Flesh-Bound Tome^^^Return the Flesh-bound Tome to Captain Gort at Agmar's Hammer.^The tome is bound in flesh and appears to be bleeding. Upon examination you discover page after page filled with strange symbols that appear to be written in blood. Whatever knowledge is held within the pages of this tome could be important. Return it to Captain Gort at Agmar's Hammer
column2: east of Icemist Village.

column1: The Runic Prophecies^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Sage Paluna^Sage Paluna^The Runic Prophecies^Deciphering the Journal^In the Name of Loken^Sage Paluna at Camp Oneqwah wants you to decipher the three Rune Plates.^Brann's journal also contained a guide to iron dwarf symbols. I've inscribed these on a keystone which will help you to understand the words inscribed on the rune plates. From the journal entries
column2: it seems Brann may be chasing after clues to the origins of his people. Keep your eyes open for any clues as to his destination. Return to Thor Modan
column3: northeast of here
column4: stand before each of the plates
column5: and use the stone to determine the contents of each. We can't allow the Alliance to find him first.

column1: A Strange Device^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Goramosh's Strange Device^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^A Strange Device^^^Deliver Goramosh's Strange Device to the Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver at Agmar's Hammer.^Picking up this strange device
column2: you are certain that it is magical in nature. Unfortunately
column3: it doesn't seem to connote any other kind of use. Perhaps the archmage back at Agmar's Hammer to the northeast of the Moonrest Gardens would be able to tell what it's used for?

column1: Projections and Plans^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Image of Archmage Modera^Image of Archmage Modera^A Strange Device^^^Get close to and observe the projection atop the Surge Needle floating above Moonrest Gardens.^This is a teleportation device. If I had to guess
column2: I'd say that it leads to the surge needle platform floating above the Moonrest Gardens to the west. I need you to use it to investigate what's up there. It appears that the device works both ways so you shouldn't have to jump off. I expect that once you teleport to the top of the surge needle
column3: there will be some sort of apparatus on it to observe. You should be able to use the teleporter from anywhere within the gardens.

column1: Projections and Plans^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^A Strange Device^^^Get close to and observe the projection atop the Surge Needle floating above Moonrest Gardens.^This is a teleportation device. If I had to guess
column2: I'd say that it leads to the surge needle platform floating above the Moonrest Gardens to the southwest. <name>
column3: I need you to use it to investigate what's up there. It appears that the device works both ways so you shouldn't have to jump off. I expect that once you teleport up to the top of the surge needle
column4: there will be some sort of apparatus on it to observe. You should be able to use the teleporter from anywhere within the gardens.

column1: Strength of Icemist^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Greatmother Icemist^Banthok Icemist^Strength of Icemist^From the Depths of Azjol-Nerub^^Find Banthok Icemist at Icemist Village.^<Greatmother Icemist bows.> It is an honor to meet you
column2: hero. It is because of your actions that many of us are here now
column3: alive and ready for battle against the Scourge. You have done so much for us that it shames me to ask you for your assistance once more. Despite my pleas
column4: my only son
column5: Banthok
column6: left here to go in search of his father
column7: High Chief Icemist. He was last seen heading west
column8: towards Icemist Village. Please find Banthok. I do not know what I would do if I lost my son.

column1: Chains of the Anub'ar^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Banthok Icemist^Banthok Icemist^Strength of Icemist^^^Banthok Icemist at Icemist Village in the Dragonblight has asked that you bring him Anok'ra's Key Fragment
column2: Tivax's Key Fragment and Sinok's Key Fragment.^They have my father bound by magical chains in the middle of Icemist Village. From what I have been able to gather
column3: the prison is controlled by three powerful Anub'ar magi - each holding a piece of the key. Scour Icemist and locate the magi. Kill them and take their key fragments. With all three pieces we might be able to free my father. Once he is free... Retribution will come swiftly.

column1: The Focus on the Beach^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Image of Archmage Modera^Image of Archmage Modera^A Strange Device^^^Obtain the Ley Line Focus Control Ring and use it to gain information from the Ley Line Focus on the Glittering Strand.^The mage hunter forces are active on the Glittering Strand to the south of Moonrest Gardens. My guess is that you'll find a heavily guarded focus on the beach and a captain who is in charge of it. No doubt the captain will have some sort of controlling device on their person. Get the controller and use it on the focus. With any luck
column2: we'll be able to get some more information about what they're really up to out there.

column1: The Focus on the Beach^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^A Strange Device^^Strengthen the Ancients^Obtain the Ley Line Focus Control Ring and use it to gain information from the Ley Line Focus on the Glittering Strand.^The mage hunter forces are active on the Glittering Strand to the south of Moonrest Gardens. My guess is that you'll find a heavily guarded focus on the beach and a captain who is in charge of it. No doubt the captain of the force down there will have some sort of controlling device on their person. Get the controller and use it on the focus. With any skill on your part
column2: we'll be able to get some more information about what they're really up to out there.

column1: A Letter for Home^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Captain Malin's Letter^Commander Saia Azuresteel^^^^Deliver Captain Malin's Letter to Commander Saia Azuresteel at Stars' Rest.^You find a letter secreted in the lining of her robes. It reads: "Father
column2: I'm sorry for disappearing on you. If you're reading this letter
column3: then I'm dead. I've been forced to work for Malygos's armies under threat that our family would be killed if I didn't. I feel so ashamed. If there's anything that you can do to fight them
column4: don't worry about me. I have them fooled and I'm sabotaging them from the inside. I love you
column5: Daddy! Em" Commander Saia Azuresteel will want to see this!

column1: Voices From the Dust^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Image of Drakuru^Image of Drakuru^Good Troll Hunting^^^Drakuru wants you to collect the Drakkari Tablets from the Ruins of Drakil'jin and 5 Sacred Mojo from Drakkari Oracles and Protectors there. You are then to use Drakuru's Elixir at Drakuru's Brazier at the ruins to summon his image.^<Drakuru places the Eye of the Prophets on his brow and the Heart of the Ancients on his chest.> We be close
column2: mon
column3: very close! The Drakkari Tablets be all dat remain ta be found. Nobody be knowin' how old dey be or what dey be sayin'
column4: but with the eye and the heart Drakuru can be readin' dem. Dey lie deep inside the crypt at Drakil'jin
column5: due east of here. Once ya got the tablets
column6: get sacred mojo from the oracles and protectors so ya can summon me there. They'd be proud to be dyin' for such a cause.

column1: Return of the High Chief^73^Horde^Dragonblight^Banthok Icemist^Overlord Agmar^Strength of Icemist^^^Free High Chief Icemist using the Anub'ar Prison Key and assist him in defeating Under-king Anub'et'kan.^<Banthok hands you the prison key.> You must hurry
column2: <name>. Take the key and use it to unchain my father from the Anub'ar prison. Once he is freed
column3: assist him in destroying the Anub'ar leader
column4: Under-king Anub'et'kan. When the Under-king is defeated
column5: take from his chitinous carapace a fragment as a trophy to present to the Horde at Agmar's Hammer. Let Agmar see the might of the High Chief!

column1: Rallying the Troops^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Kurun^Kurun^Find Kurun!^^^Use the Shard of the Earth to rally the Grizzly Hills Giants fighting in the Boulder Hills
column2: kill any iron dwarves who oppose you
column3: then report to Kurun on the hill overlooking Thor Modan.^The sons of iron have used their runes to enthrall many of my brothers and are using them to break the siege on Thor Modan. I wish we did not have to fight them
column4: but we have no choice. My giants will not hold out long against them. I have imbued this earthen shard with a blessing that will aid our allies. Take it with you to the battle in the Boulder Hills to the north
column5: and use it to reassure and fortify my brethren. Kill any iron dwarves who would stand in your way.

column1: Attack by Air!^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Senior Sergeant Juktok^Valnok Windrager^Victory Nears...^^^Speak with Valnok Windrager at Agmar's Hammer.^They have seen the might of the Horde by land
column2: now they must feel it from the air! I want you to report to Valnok Windrager at once! You will find him here
column3: in Agmar's Hammer. Valnok has already been briefed on your mission and is expecting you.

column1: Blightbeasts be Damned!^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Valnok Windrager^Valnok Windrager^Victory Nears...^^The Kor'kron Vanguard!^Use Valnok's Flare Gun to call down a Kor'kron War Rider at Icemist Village. Mount the Kor'kron War Rider and then use it to kill 25 Anub'ar Blightbeasts!^You've no doubt seen the army of Anub'ar blightbeasts that are being constructed at Icemist Village. The Anub'ar have plans to send those monsters against our soldiers at the Wrathgate. This cannot happen! Venture west to Icemist Village with this flare gun and use it to call down one of my war riders. Climb on its back and command it to destroy the blightbeasts that are out of reach from the ground! Once you have decimated their aerial forces
column2: return to me for your reward!

column1: Pounding the Iron^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Scout Vor'takh^Scout Vor'takh^Pounding the Iron^Deciphering the Journal^In the Name of Loken^Kill any 10 Iron Dwarves defending Thor Modan and report back to Scout Vor'takh at Camp Oneqwah.^The Alliance isn't the only force opposing us in Grizzly Hills. The iron dwarves have firm control of the eastern coast
column2: although Thor Modan
column3: to the northeast
column4: is besieged by stone giants. A skilled warrior uses an enemy's weakness against him and we would be fools to ignore the vulnerability of the iron dwarves at Thor Modan. Show the iron dwarves no mercy. Slay any and all who would stand in your way. The 'sons of iron' will learn to fear the Horde.

column1: An Expedient Ally^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Scout Vor'takh^Kurun^An Expedient Ally^^Raining Down Destruction^Speak with Kurun on the hill overlooking Thor Modan.^The old iron dwarf capital of Thor Modan
column2: far to the northeast
column3: is under siege by a mysterious band of stone giants and earthen. Why the creations of the titans would war against each other is beyond my understanding and the Horde's interest
column4: but there is an opportunity here to weaken a mutual enemy. Travel to Thor Modan and seek out this 'Kurun' who commands the giants and earthen. Make common cause with him and use his forces to crush the iron dwarves.

column1: Slim Pickings^74^All^Dragonblight^Zort^Zort^Stiff Negotiations^^^Collect a sample of Rockflesh from the Ice Giant corpse at the cavern entrance in the Crystal Vice
column2: north of Zort's location. After this task is complete
column3: return to Zort near the center of the canyon.^Cold out here
column4: isn't it
column5: <race>? Ko'char has refused to meet with me. It seems he has more pressing things on his mind - namely
column6: the jormungar that have been attacking them from the cavern below. Maybe you can help me convince Ko'char that I'm one of the good guys. I saw a giant being eaten by some of the worms at the entrance to the cavern north of here... I'm still puzzled as to how the worms are killing them so easily. Bring me a sample from one of his wounds.

column1: Messy Business^74^All^Dragonblight^Zort^Zort^Stiff Negotiations^^^Collect 2 Vials of Corrosive Spit from the Jormungar by using the scraper on yourself. Bring the vials back to Zort in the Crystal Vice when your task is complete.^Even at first glance
column2: the sample you brought me shows obvious signs of some kind of corrosive spit. It would be a natural assumption that the same substance these worms use to burrow through the ground has allowed them a formidable weapon against the Ice Giants. Take this scraper and pick a fight with some of the worms. When they spit on you
column3: use the scraper to remove it and bring it back to me. Get me a couple samples - I'm going to have to use it as the base for an elixir.

column1: Apply This Twice A Day^74^All^Dragonblight^Zort^Ko'char the Unbreakable^Stiff Negotiations^^^Offer the elixir that Zort has prepared to Ko'char the Unbreakable.^This elixir should protect against their spit. Offer it to Ko'char for me
column2: will you? Tell him there's plenty more where that came from if he'll return the favor.

column1: Worm Wrangler^74^All^Dragonblight^Zort^Zort^^^^Enter the caverns in Crystal Vice and trap 3 Jormungar Spawn inside sturdy crates. Be sure to pick the crates up after the Jormungar Spawn are trapped inside!^So be it. If the giants will not come to our aid
column2: perhaps we can make use of these worms. There are sure to be some spawn with their brood mother in the cavern below. Take this box and capture 3 of their spawn and bring them to me. Where diplomacy fails
column3: enslaving is a perfectly viable alternative.

column1: Stomping Grounds^74^All^Dragonblight^Ko'char the Unbreakable^Ko'char the Unbreakable^^^^Delve into the cavern at the north end of the Crystal Vice and kill 8 Ice Heart Jormungar Feeders for Ko'char the Unbreakable.^Greetings little one. I know not what madness has brought you to the Crystal Vice
column2: but you are welcome in my presence. These ice worms... these jormungar have taken a taste to eating my brothers. I doubt you will find my kind friendly by any terms during this time of battle
column3: but if you are here to help with the worms
column4: then you have my ear. If we are to take the cavern back
column5: we must first clear the canyon of these jormungar feeders. Join us in battle
column6: <race>!

column1: Really Big Worm^74^All^Dragonblight^Ko'char the Unbreakable^Ko'char the Unbreakable^^^^Enter the Ice Heart Cavern and slay Rattlebore. If it is still in your possession
column2: be sure to use Zort's Protective Elixir to protect you from the Jormungar's corrosive spit.^The jormungar have a spawnmother in the caverns below. We call her Rattlebore - a name that was gifted to her by an adventurer from the Plaguelands. I saw her only briefly as I was fighting off their initial onslaught - she is large enough to make even my icy bones shiver. This cavern will not be ours until she is removed from it. Gather your friends and end this.

column1: Gavrock^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Kurun^Gavrock^Find Kurun!^^^Speak with Gavrock at the Ruins of Tethys.^Without your help
column2: we wouldn't have been able to turn the tide of the battle for Thor Modan. This ancient city has long been a battlefield between the forces of earth and stone. I can only hope we have silenced it for the last time. The iron dwarves can still use their magic to capture and enslave my brothers. Gavrock is searching for a way to free the runed giants. Look for him on a small cluster of islands
column3: called the Ruins of Tethys
column4: off the central part of the Eastwind Shore to the south.

column1: Dun-da-Dun-tah!^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Harrison Jones^Harkor^^^^Escort Harrison from Drakil'jin Ruins
column2: then speak with Harkor at Harkor's Camp.^Listen
column3: kid. This is no place for you to be playin' around. I'm about to make a break for it. Stick with me and I'll get you outta here.

column1: Atop the Woodlands^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Image of Archmage Modera^Image of Archmage Modera^A Strange Device^^^Obtain the Ley Line Focus Control Amulet and use it to gain information from the Ley Line Focus in the Lothalor Woodlands.^I'm convinced that there must be more of those foci
column2: each of them in-turn redirecting the ley line energies. We still don't know precisely what they're doing with all of that power
column3: though. My guess is that you'll find another one atop the Lothalor Woodlands to the southeast. Once again you'll need to find the person in charge and take whatever controlling device they have in their possession as I'm sure that each focus has its own. Be careful
column4: <name>
column5: those woods are very dangerous.

column1: Atop the Woodlands^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^A Strange Device^^^Obtain the Ley Line Focus Control Amulet and use it to gain information from the Ley Line Focus in the Lothalor Woodlands.^I'm convinced that there must be more of those foci
column2: each of them in-turn redirecting the ley line energies. We still don't know precisely what they're doing with all of that power
column3: though. My guess is that you'll find another one atop the Lothalor Woodlands to the south. Once again you'll need to find the person in charge and take whatever controlling device they have in their possession as I'm sure that each focus has its own. Be quick about your business
column4: <class>. I feel that time may be running out.

column1: A Letter for Home^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Lieutenant Ta'zinni's Letter^Overlord Agmar^^^^Deliver Lieutenant Ta'zinni's Letter to Overlord Agmar at Agmar's Hammer.^You find a letter secreted in the lining of his robes. It reads: "Deino
column2: Ta'zinni sorry for disappearing on ya. If you're reading this letter
column3: then I be dead. I been forced to work for Malygos's armies under threat that the family would be killed if I didn't. Ta'zinni wasn't gonna let that happen! Don't worry about me
column4: just keep your kids safe. I have them fooled and I'm sabotaging them from the inside. I love you
column5: sistah! Ta'zinni" Overlord Agmar is sure to want to see this!

column1: The Son of Karkut^72^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Ataika^Corporal Venn^Word on the Street^^^Go east to Death's Stand
column2: just beyond Unu'pe.^The man you seek went far to the east
column3: to a place near the coast called Death's Stand
column4: beyond Unu'pe. Be careful if you go in search of him
column5: <name>. He bore the mark of Karkut... he who watches over the dead.

column1: Thassarian
column2: the Death Knight^72^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Corporal Venn^Thassarian^Word on the Street^^^Look for Thassarian inside the Wailing Ziggurat
column3: north of Death's Stand.^Well
column4: <name>
column5: you helped us out... so I figure it's only fair that we help you out as well. You're looking for Thassarian? He disappeared this morning. We think he went off north to the Wailing Ziggurat. If we hadn't fought side by side by him we'd even think he was a traitor. See
column6: he's a Death Knight... and I know they're on our side and all... but it wasn't too long ago they were servants of Arthas. But not Thassarian
column7: he's a good guy. Go to the Wailing Ziggurat
column8: see if he's doing okay.

column1: Wanted: Magister Keldonus^74^Horde^Dragonblight^Wanted!^Captain Gort^^^To Dragon's Fall^Slay Magister Keldonus and return to Captain Gort at Agmar's Hammer in the Dragonblight.^By decree of Overlord Agmar: Target: Magister Keldonus Crime: Treason Status: Alive Magister Keldonus
column2: once mage commander of Agmar's Hammer
column3: is to be killed on sight in the name of the Horde. Keldonus was last seen traveling southwest towards Moonrest Gardens to join the Blue Dragonflight in their campaign against magic. Approach with caution as Keldonus is a powerful magus. Do not engage solo! All bounties are paid out by Captain Gort at Agmar's Hammer.

column1: Wanted: Gigantaur^74^Horde^Dragonblight^Wanted!^Captain Gort^^^To Dragon's Fall^Slay Gigantaur and return to Captain Gort at Agmar's Hammer in the Dragonblight.^By decree of Overlord Agmar: Target: Gigantaur Crime: Attacks upon the Horde; "Bein' ugly" Status: Alive The magnataur lord
column2: Gigantaur
column3: is wanted in relation to a number of attacks against Horde soldiers and installations in the Dragonblight. Gigantaur was last seen wandering the woods and roads south by southeast of Agmar's Hammer. Gigantaur should be considered armed and extremely dangerous. Do not engage solo! All bounties are paid out by Captain Gort at Agmar's Hammer.

column1: Wanted: Dreadtalon^74^Horde^Dragonblight^Wanted!^Captain Gort^^^To Dragon's Fall^Slay Dreadtalon and return to Captain Gort at Agmar's Hammer in the Dragonblight.^By decree of Overlord Agmar: Target: Dreadtalon Crime: Attacks upon the Horde Status: Alive Dreadtalon is wanted for numerous attacks upon Horde caravans traveling to and from Venomspite. Dreadtalon makes his home on a bluff overlooking the Ruby Dragonshrine
column2: east of Agmar's Hammer. He should be approached with extreme caution. Do not engage solo! All bounties are paid out by Captain Gort at Agmar's Hammer.

column1: Strengthen the Ancients^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Sarendryana^Sarendryana^^^^Use the Bark of the Walkers to strengthen 3 Lothalor Ancients and then return to Sarendryana at Stars' Rest.^It's not only the <race> race that has been impacted by what the blue dragonflight forces have done. The ancients of the Lothalor Woods to the southeast have been affected as well. Some have been corrupted-- avoid them at all costs--but most can still be saved. However
column2: the treants of the woods seem to be immune to the magic seeping through the land and the arcane wyrms that have come with it. Ask the treants for their bark and feed it to the ancients. Hopefully that will be enough to save them.

column1: Runes of Compulsion^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Gavrock^Gavrock^Find Kurun!^^^Gavrock
column2: at the Ruins of Tethys
column3: wants you to neutralize the four Runes of Compulsion by defeating Overseer Durval
column4: Overseer Korgan
column5: Overseer Lochli
column6: and Overseer Brunon.^Even as Kurun attacks Thor Modan
column7: the iron dwarves work their magics against our brothers. Summoning our brothers from the earth
column8: then binding them with runes
column9: the sons of iron force them to war against the children of stone. Along the Eastwind Shore
column10: they use runes of compulsion to send enslaved giants to the battlefields of the north. Find the four runes of compulsion and force their overseers to appear by defeating the rune-weavers who man each rune. Without the overseers
column11: the runes are useless.

column1: Latent Power^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Gavrock^Gavrock^Find Kurun!^^^Charge the Shard of Gavrock at the First Ancient Stone
column2: the Second Ancient Stone
column3: and the Third Ancient Stone
column4: then return to Gavrock at the Ruins of Tethys.^While the runes of compulsion are dormant
column5: there is a chance we can release the runed giants. I will give you a piece of stone that has been part of me since my creation. If properly imbued
column6: it can be used to free the bound giants. Two ancient stone markers sit atop places of power between the Path of Iron and the forest's edge -- locations your people would call the intersections of ley lines. The other is on an island at the southern end of these ruins. Charge the shard at each stone and return.

column1: To Dragon's Fall^75^Horde^Dragonblight^Captain Gort^Rokhan^To Dragon's Fall^Wanted: Magister Keldonus
column2: Wanted: Gigantaur
column3: Wanted: Dreadtalon^^Speak with Rokhan at Dragon's Fall in the Dragonblight.^East of here
column4: in the heart of the Dragonblight
column5: is a field full of nothing but dragon bones and snow. The Scourge have set up multiple camps in the central tundra and are raising frostwyrms to send against our forces at the Wrathgate. While most of these frostwyrms are easily dealt with by Rokhan and his dragon hunters
column6: one of them is proving to be a bit problematic. Go northeast and seek out Rokhan at Dragon's Fall. Help him and his men put down Sarathstra and you'll be rewarded handsomely!

column1: Strengthen the Ancients^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Earthwarden Grife^Earthwarden Grife^^The Focus on the Beach^^Use the Bark of the Walkers to strengthen 3 Lothalor Ancients and then return to Earthwarden Grife at Agmar's Hammer.^The ancients of the Lothalor Woods to the south are being corrupted by arcane wyrms... wyrms which have risen out of the ground! Those that are already corrupted are deadly and of no use to us
column2: but most can still be saved. Luckily
column3: the treants of the woods seem to be immune to everything happening up there. Ask the treants for their bark and when you get some
column4: feed it to the ancients. This should strengthen them. Now leave me to my business! I have to keep an eye on these apothecaries.

column1: Sarathstra
column2: Scourge of the North^75^Horde^Dragonblight^Rokhan^Captain Gort^To Dragon's Fall^^^Speak with Rokhan to call down the frostwyrm
column3: Sarathstra.^Me hunters be dead or frozen
column4: <name>. Just you and whatever allies you bring wit ya is all da help you get. You still want to do dis? Just say da word and me call for da dragon once more. If ya kill it
column5: take da beast's frozen heart back to Agmar's Hammer and present it to Gort. He sure to reward you good
column6: mon.

column1: Search Indu'le Village^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Image of Archmage Modera^Mage-Commander Evenstar^A Strange Device^^^Search for the commander of the mage hunter forces at Indu'le Village and Lake Indu'le.^I'm certain that you'll find the next ley line focus somewhere in the remains of Indu'le Village to the southeast. The problem is
column2: we've had absolutely no reports of there being one there. If you would
column3: please investigate the village for any signs of the focus or the mage hunters and their commander in the area. Don't forget to search in the lake if you have to.

column1: Free at Last^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Gavrock^Gavrock^Find Kurun!^^^Use Gavrock's Runebreaker to free 4 Runed Giants
column2: then return to Gavrock at the Ruins of Tethys.^The rock shard you imbued should be powerful enough to break the runic magic binding my brothers. Take it with you and find the runed giants walking north along the Eastwind Shore. Unleash the power stored in the stone and observe the results. If it works
column3: the runed giants should return to their senses and stop obeying the iron dwarves. If the stone fails to work
column4: the giants may attack in a weakened state. But
column5: what choice do we have? If we do not try
column6: they will remain enslaved without hope.

column1: Containing the Rot^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Soar Hawkfury^Soar Hawkfury^Containing the Rot^Agmar's Hammer^^Soar Hawkfury at Agmar's Hammer in the Dragonblight wants you to kill 15 Infected Wildlife and recover a Rot Resistant Organ.^With Scourge comes death and disease. We often overlook that the wildlife of a Scourge infested area is ravaged and ultimately destroyed by rot and contagion. For most of the indigenous beasts of the Dragonblight it is too late. The festering disease that the Scourge brings has already infected the beasts and they are now rabid and rotting. You must venture west
column2: towards the Pit of Narjun
column3: and cull the infected wildlife. Check their corpses for a preserved organ as we need one to devise a vaccine.

column1: The Good Doctor...^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Soar Hawkfury^Doctor Sintar Malefious^Containing the Rot^^^Deliver the Rot Resistant Organ to Doctor Sintar Malefious at Agmar's Hammer.^Our Forsaken allies have sent their apothecary core here to assist us in destroying the Scourge at the Wrathgate. One among them
column2: Doctor Sintar Malefious
column3: is well versed in the Scourge rot and methods of containing the spread. I had previously worked out a deal with him in regards to devising a vaccine for wildlife. He's since been waiting on the organ. Deliver this rot resistant organ to Dr. Malefious and let him know it's from me. He'll direct you on your next task.

column1: In Search of the Ruby Lilac^73^Horde^Dragonblight^Doctor Sintar Malefious^Doctor Sintar Malefious^Containing the Rot^^^Doctor Sintar Malefious at Agmar's Hammer in the Dragonblight wants you to collect 1 Ruby Lilac.^How fortuitous it is that the Ruby Dragonshrine lays just to the east. It is there that you will find a flower called the ruby lilac. This lifegiving plant is all that I need to concoct a vaccine for the untainted beasts of this region. Travel east and search the Ruby Dragonshrine for the lilac. Just one thing: The dragonshrine
column2: like all the dragonshrines in this blasted wasteland
column3: is beset by the Scourge. Watch your step. We wouldn't want you to be devoured by an emberwyrm. <Sintar laughs.>

column1: Return to Soar^73^Horde^Dragonblight^Doctor Sintar Malefious^Soar Hawkfury^Containing the Rot^^^Deliver Sintar's Vaccine to Soar Hawkfury at Agmar's Hammer.^<Doctor Malefious hands you a vial full of murky liquid.> Here you are then
column2: <race>. Take this back to the cow and let him know that all debts have been paid. We are officially "square." Now leave me before I set Jennings upon you.

column1: Descent into Darkness^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Mikhail's Journal^Lieutenant Dumont^Descent into Darkness^^^Bring Mikhail's Journal to Lieutenant Dumont in Amberpine Lodge.^The journal was written by a denizen of Silverbrook named Mikhail. It details the arrival of a shadow-worshipping group called the "wolfcult." The villagers were reluctant to embrace the cult at first
column2: but sympathizers sprung up gradually among town residents. Unsettled by this
column3: Mikhail sent his daughter Sasha away from Silverbrook while he attempted to reason with the other villagers. Mikhail's last entry mentions a meeting of local town leaders to discuss unspecified events in Hollowstone Mine.

column1: Search Indu'le Village^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^Mage-Commander Evenstar^A Strange Device^^^Search for the commander of the mage hunter forces at Indu'le Village and Lake Indu'le.^I'm certain that you'll find the next ley line focus somewhere in the remains of Indu'le Village to the southeast. The problem is
column2: I've had absolutely no reports of there being one there. I need you to go investigate the village for any signs of the focus or the mage hunters and their commander in the area. Search in the lake if you have to!

column1: The End of the Line^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Mage-Commander Evenstar^Image of Archmage Modera^A Strange Device^^^Use the Ley Line Focus Control Talisman to gain information from the Ley Line Focus under Lake Indu'le. Then
column2: head east to the Azure Dragonshrine near south central Dragonblight and observe what is occurring there from the western ledge.^Within his robes you find two things of interest. One is a talisman
column3: which is clearly a focus controlling device. The other is a set of orders from someone named Sidragos
column4: which were ultimately intended for the leader back at the Moonrest Gardens. The water-soaked parchment informs Goramosh that he is to move all mage hunter forces east to the Azure Dragonshrine. Perhaps you should get what information you can from the focus and head east to observe the dragonshrine from its western ledge.

column1: Report to Gryan Stoutmantle... Again^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Lieutenant Dumont^Captain Gryan Stoutmantle^Descent into Darkness^^^Speak to Captain Gryan Stoutmantle at the Westfall Brigade Encampment.^The Westfall boys were sent east to look for a path into the northern territories. Their secondary objective is to secure strategic resource points
column2: so I'm sure they wouldn't mind investigating a mine. Look for the Westfall Brigade encampment far to the northeast and seek out Gryan Stoutmantle. You might remember him if you ever spent any time in Westfall. Make sure to tell him I sent you. He'll be more than happy to let you claim a functioning mine for the king.

column1: The End of the Line^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Mage-Commander Evenstar^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^A Strange Device^^^Use the Ley Line Focus Control Talisman to gain information from the Ley Line Focus under Lake Indu'le. Then
column2: head east to the Azure Dragonshrine near south central Dragonblight and observe what is occurring there from the western ledge^Within his robes you find two things of interest. One is a talisman
column3: which is clearly a focus controlling device. The other is a set of orders from someone named Sidragos
column4: which were ultimately intended for the leader back at the Moonrest Gardens. The fragile water-soaked parchment informs Goramosh that he is to move all mage hunter forces east to the Azure Dragonshrine. Perhaps you should get what information you can from the focus and head east to observe the dragonshrine from its western ledge.

column1: Where the Wild Things Roam^73^Horde^Dragonblight^Soar Hawkfury^Soar Hawkfury^Containing the Rot^^^Soar Hawkfury at Agmar's Hammer in the Dragonblight wants you to use the Pack of Vaccine to vaccinate 5 Snowfall Elk and 5 Arctic Grizzlies.^Inside this pack are several vials containing the vaccine that Sintar created. I now want you to search the nearby woods for Snowfall elk and arctic grizzlies. When you locate the animals
column2: find a safe distance and throw a vial in their general direction. The vial will shatter and release a fine gas that will act as the inoculating agent. The beasts merely have to step inside the gas and they will be vaccinated - ultimately saved. Inoculate as many of the beasts as you can and return to me.

column1: Stiff Negotiations^74^All^Dragonblight^Narf^Zort^Stiff Negotiations^^^Locate Zort in the center of the Crystal Vice
column2: northeast of Nozzlerust Post.^Well it seems you were of a bit of use after all. It's not been my experience to meet many a <race> that are. We don't have any more use for you here. Head into the Vice and see if my brother Zort could use a hand. He went to see if he could con the giants into laying down their lives so that we don't have to. He certainly wasn't known for having the brains in the family.

column1: Nice to Meat You^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Harkor^Harkor^^^^Harkor at Harkor's Camp wants you to collect 10 pieces of Fibrous Worg Meat from Duskhowl Prowlers and 10 Shovelhorn Steaks from Longhoof Grazers.^G'day to ya
column2: <class>! Have yerself a seat by me fire
column3: eh? I'd offer to share a nice hot meal
column4: only I ain't got one. I'm stuck here waitin' on an associate
column5: or I'd be out tryin' to remedy that situation meself. Say
column6: you seem to have nuthin' but time on yer hands and there be plenty o' meat in these parts. What say ya lend a hand and round up some grub?

column1: Therapy^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Harkor^Harkor^^^^Harkor at Harkor's Camp wants you to kill 10 Drakkari Protectors and 10 Drakkari Oracles outside Drakil'jin Ruins.^Trolls... me hates 'em all! <Harkor spits.> I once got meself captured by a band o' tha beasts... came this close ta gettin' me head shrunk! Me friends tell me to just move on and put it all behind me
column2: but that just ain't sittin' right. Wanna know what would make me feel better
column3: <race>? Seein' a pile of their corpses so high it blots out the sun! I've got good gold to spend if ya can make that happen.

column1: Koltira and the Language of Death^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Captain Gort^Koltira Deathweaver^The Flesh-Bound Tome^^In Service of Blood
column2: In Service of the Unholy
column3: In Service of Frost^Take the Flesh-Bound Tome to Koltira Deathweaver.^There is one who recently joined our cause that might be able to decipher this tome. An unbound death knight known as Koltira Deathweaver has temporarily taken residence here at Agmar's Hammer. As he was once a death knight of Arthas and member of the Scourge
column4: he might be able to translate the language of the dead. Take the flesh-bound tome to Koltira and ask him to translate the pages.

column1: It Takes Guts....^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Kraz^Kraz^It Takes Guts....^^^Kraz at Harkor's Camp wants you to enter Drakil'jin Ruins and collect 5 Drakkari Canopic Jars.^Greetings
column2: <class>. It is kind of you to stop and listen to Kraz's tale. For many years Kraz has strained to hear the spirits and do their bidding. Recently
column3: many voices have been crying to Kraz from these ruins. They seek for a peace they cannot find on their own. If you would help the spirits of those who have come before
column4: enter this crypt and collect something that once belonged to those tormented souls.

column1: Travel to Moa'ki Harbor^72^All^Dragonblight^Hotawa^Elder Ko'nani^^The Tides Turn^^Travel to Moa'ki Harbor in the Dragonblight and speak with Elder Ko'nani.^<race>
column2: word just arrived from Moa'ki Harbor. Something very bad happened over there this morning! You've been very helpful to us here. Would you consider using the boat from Unu'pe to travel to the great Dragonblight? By the sound of things
column3: Elder Ko'nani could certainly use your assistance.

column1: Travel to Moa'ki Harbor^72^All^Dragonblight^Anuniaq^Elder Ko'nani^^Avenge Iskaal^^Travel to Moa'ki Harbor in the Dragonblight and speak with Elder Ko'nani.^<race>
column2: word just came in off the boat from Moa'ki Harbor. Something very bad happened over there this morning! You've been very helpful to us here. Would you consider using the boat to travel to the great Dragonblight? By the sound of things
column3: Elder Ko'nani could certainly use your assistance.

column1: Gaining an Audience^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Image of Archmage Modera^Tariolstrasz^A Strange Device^^^Deliver your Letter of Introduction to Wyrmrest Temple to Tariolstrasz at Wyrmrest Temple.^<name>
column2: you must travel as swiftly as you can to Wyrmrest Temple and present this letter to the steward
column3: Tariolstrasz. The temple sits in the center of the Dragonblight. Follow the road east until it ends
column4: and then cross The Dragon Wastes to get to it. I'm sure that when the steward reads your introduction
column5: he'll see to it that you gain an audience with Queen Alexstrasza. We can only hope that we're not too late. Thank you for all that you have done on our behalf. Safe journeys!

column1: Drak'aguul's Mallet^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Kraz^Kraz^It Takes Guts....^^^Kraz at Harkor's Camp wants you to slay Drak'aguul outside Drakil'jin Ruins and return with the Drakil'jin Mallet.^Corruption.... Even before you delivered these jars
column2: Kraz could sense it. This corruption fills the ancient Drakkari spirits with great angst and prevents them from entering the rest they seek. Kraz will not lie
column3: <class>. Cleansing this place will require great sacrifice
column4: but we shall speak of that at another time. There is one among the living here who holds the key to its cleansing. Seek out Drak'aguul and return to Kraz with the mallet he carries.

column1: See You on the Other Side^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Kraz^Gan'jo^It Takes Guts....^^^Kraz at Harkor's Camp wants you to use the Drakil'jin Mallet on the gongs outside Drakil'jin Ruins. Once you have been slain
column2: you are to enter the ruins and speak with the spirit of Gan'jo while you are dead.^These Drakkari have met you with nothing but savage hostility. You owe them nothing. Few indeed would carry out the task that Kraz asks of you today. To cleanse this place and send the spirits to their eternal rest
column3: you must join them in death. There is one inside the crypt who awaits you - on the other side. He holds the knowledge we seek
column4: <name>. Use the mallet on the gongs. The spirit of he who corrupts this place will surely deliver you to the spirit world. Kraz awaits your return.

column1: Gaining an Audience^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^Tariolstrasz^A Strange Device^^^Deliver your Letter of Introduction to Wyrmrest Temple to Tariolstrasz at Wyrmrest Temple.^<name>
column2: you must travel as swiftly as you can to Wyrmrest Temple and present this letter to the steward
column3: Tariolstrasz. The temple sits in the center of the Dragonblight. Follow the road east until it ends
column4: and then cross The Dragon Wastes to get to it. I'm sure that when the steward reads your introduction
column5: he'll see to it that you gain an audience with Queen Alexstrasza. We can only hope that we're not too late. Thank you for all that you have done on our behalf. Safe journeys!

column1: Informing the Queen^75^Alliance^Dragonblight^Tariolstrasz^Alexstrasza the Life-Binder^A Strange Device^^Report to Lord Afrasastrasz^Deliver your Letter of Introduction to Wyrmrest Temple to Alexstrasza the Life-Binder at Wyrmrest Temple.^<The dragon steward pulls your letter of introduction out of his sleeve.> Yes... yes
column2: I think that you are ready to see the queen now. When you are ready
column3: speak to me again and I will see to it that one of these drakes delivers you safely to the top of the temple. You will need to present your letter in person to Queen Alexstrasza.

column1: Informing the Queen^75^Horde^Dragonblight^Tariolstrasz^Alexstrasza the Life-Binder^A Strange Device^^Report to Lord Afrasastrasz^Deliver your Letter of Introduction to Wyrmrest Temple to Alexstrasza the Life-Binder at Wyrmrest Temple.^<The dragon steward pulls your letter of introduction out of his sleeve.> Yes... yes
column2: I think that you are ready to see the queen now. When you are ready
column3: speak to me again and I will see to it that one of these drakes delivers you safely to the top of the temple. You will need to present your letter in person to Queen Alexstrasza.

column1: In Service of Blood^73^Horde^Dragonblight^Koltira Deathweaver^Koltira Deathweaver^^Koltira and the Language of Death^The Power to Destroy^Koltira Deathweaver at Agmar's Hammer in the Dragonblight wants you to use the Blood Gem on a Deranged Indu'le Villager and return to him with a Filled Blood Gem.^The blood of innocents was once used to sate the thirst of the blade. Alas
column2: such options are no longer available to me. <Koltira pauses to think.> We must improvise. South of here
column3: upon the high bluffs
column4: is the tuskarr village of Indu'le. Having been recently overrun by the Blue Dragonflight's chaotic magic
column5: the resident tuskarr of Indu'le have gone mad. Take this blood gem and use it on a deranged villager. If I cannot take the blood of innocents
column6: I shall have the blood of the meek!

column1: In Service of the Unholy^73^Horde^Dragonblight^Koltira Deathweaver^Koltira Deathweaver^^Koltira and the Language of Death^The Power to Destroy^Koltira Deathweaver at Agmar's Hammer in the Dragonblight wants you to use the Unholy Gem on Duke Vallenhal and return to him with a Filled Unholy Gem.^The power of the unholy is coveted among my kind. It makes up the very fiber of our existence
column2: granting death to those that dare make a mockery of it! Thankfully there is a font from which I may draw from in my time of need. Take this unholy gem and make your way to the Ruby Dragonshrine
column3: east of here. It is there that you will find Duke Vallenhal
column4: death knight of Arthas. Weaken his resolve in battle and unleash the power of the gem upon him. It will finish him off and steal his unholy energy!

column1: In Service of Frost^73^Horde^Dragonblight^Koltira Deathweaver^Koltira Deathweaver^^Koltira and the Language of Death^The Power to Destroy^Koltira Deathweaver at Agmar's Hammer in the Dragonblight wants you to use the Frost Gem on Ice Revenants and return to him with a Filled Frost Gem.^The biting cold protects the death knight while repelling his enemies. He that commands the power of frost can incite chaos and destruction! Take this frost gem and travel far across the open tundra of the Dragonblight until you come upon the Mirror of Dawn
column2: east of Wyrmrest Temple. It is there that you are to battle the legions of ice revenants that dwell upon the lakes surface and take from them the essence of frost. Utilize the power of the gem when they are weak
column3: <name>!

column1: Check Up on Raegar^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Brugar Stoneshear^Raegar Breakbrow^Check Up on Raegar^Steady as a Rock?^^Speak with Raegar Breakbrow at Prospector's Point.^With all the excitement about the army trying to move through Thor Modan
column2: I'd almost forgotten about Raegar's crew down at Prospector's Point. I sent Raegar and his assistants
column3: along with a mountaineer friend
column4: down to establish a small post near Dun Argol
column5: at the southern end of the Eastwind Shore. They were to investigate the iron dwarf presence in the southern hills
column6: but I haven't received any reports yet. Could you check up on them if you're going down that way?

column1: The Perfect Plan^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Raegar Breakbrow^Raegar Breakbrow^Check Up on Raegar^^^Bring the completed War Golem Blueprint to Raegar Breakbrow at Prospector's Point.^The iron dwarves are making no secret of the fact that they're preparing for war. With their giants
column2: golems
column3: and lightning elementals
column4: they'd have a technological advantage against the Westfall Brigade. If they don't find passage north in time
column5: the irons could take them by surprise. We've got to tie them up here
column6: and I've got just the way to do it. Dun Argol is full of rune-smiths churning out war golems. They carry plans for specific pieces
column7: so you'll need to find and assemble all the parts.

column1: Why Fabricate When You Can Appropriate?^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Raegar Breakbrow^Raegar Breakbrow^Check Up on Raegar^^^Bring 8 War Golem Parts to Raegar Breakbrow at Prospector's Point.^We've got the blueprints
column2: but we can't do anything with them without parts! We don't have access to a foundry
column3: much less materials
column4: but there's a whole load of parts up in Dun Argol. Your job? Give them a new home. They're likely to be scattered around any of the buildings where the iron rune-smiths are working
column5: and I wouldn't blame the irons for being cranky when you try to filch their handiwork. The more parts you can bring
column6: the better we can make this golem.

column1: We Have the Power^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Raegar Breakbrow^Raegar Breakbrow^Check Up on Raegar^^^Bring Durar's Power Cell and Kathorn's Power Cell to Raegar Breakbrow at Prospector's Point.^We're almost there
column2: but the war golem won't run without power cells. From the information I was able to collect in Dun Argol before we were discovered
column3: both Rune-Smith Durar and Rune-Smith Kathorn each create one power cell. We'll need one power cell from each of the rune-smiths before our golem will work. You should be able to find each rune-smith in his workshop on the central level of Dun Argol.

column1: The Power to Destroy^73^Horde^Dragonblight^Koltira Deathweaver^Koltira Deathweaver^The Power to Destroy^In Service of Blood
column2: In Service of the Unholy
column3: In Service of Frost^^Koltira Deathweaver at Agmar's Hammer in the Dragonblight wants you to enter the world of shadows and defeat 6 Shadowy Tormentors.^While you have done much for me
column4: one task remains. Beside the world you know exists another world. It is from that world
column5: the world of shadows
column6: that my tormentors assault me. While I am powerless to face my own demons
column7: you could end their reign of terror. You have the strength
column8: I have seen it with my own eyes. Enter the world of shadows and face the demons that torment me! Do this and I will translate the tome
column9: as promised.

column1: Sasha's Hunt^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Sasha^Sasha^^Fate and Coincidence^^Sasha wants you to kill 12 Solstice Hunters in Solstice Village.^This thing... this curse... that's affecting Silverbrook and Solstice Village... it makes beasts out of people. My father tried to warn them
column2: but they all listened to the wolfcult instead. They're too far gone now
column3: it's time to put them down... for their own sake.

column1: The Translated Tome^73^Horde^Dragonblight^Koltira Deathweaver^Captain Gort^The Power to Destroy^^^Deliver the Translated Flesh-bound Tome to Captain Gort at Agmar's Hammer.^Here it is
column2: <name>. I have translated everything printed upon the pages of the tome. Inside it you will find a list of the names of Cult of the Damned members spanning the entire continent. Their network of spies and operatives is impressive
column3: to say the least. Farewell
column4: friend. May the book serve you and your people well.

column1: Chill Out
column2: Mon^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Gan'jo^Kraz^It Takes Guts....^^^Gan'jo wants you to collect the Snow of Eternal Slumber from his chest in the Drakil'jin Ruins.^It be as the prophecies said
column3: mon. A <race> <class> be comin' to set our spirits to rest. We been waitin' for a long time now! The Drakkari have become a lost people
column4: fierce and savage. But here we suffer by no fault of our own
column5: mon. This place need cleansin' and only the living can do it. Speak to me when ya be ready to rejoin your body. Then take the snow from the chest near me here and put my bruddas to sleep. Take their remnants to your spirit guide. He be knowin' what to do next.

column1: ... Or Maybe We Don't^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Raegar Breakbrow^Raegar Breakbrow^Check Up on Raegar^^The Iron Thane and His Anvil
column2: Blackout^Charge your War Golem with the energy from 10 Lightning Sentries and return to Raegar Breakbrow at Prospector's Point.^You'd think the guys making the power cells would've thought to power them up
column3: but no
column4: they've got to make it difficult for us. Fine
column5: we'll charge those cells the hard way. There's enough power in them to run the golem for a short time
column6: but don't expect it to be any good in combat. You see the lightning sentries that the irons have posted around the perimeter of Dun Argol? Bring the golem with you
column7: take it close to them
column8: and use the golem to absorb the power as the sentries die.

column1: All Hail Roanauk!^73^Horde^Dragonblight^Overlord Agmar^Overlord Agmar^Strength of Icemist^^The Kor'kron Vanguard!^Seek out Roanauk Icemist at Agmar's Hammer and initiate him as a member and leader of the Horde forces.^Like the tauren
column2: Forsaken
column3: trolls and blood elves
column4: so too do the taunka need a leader born of their own blood. The one you saved from Icemist
column5: Roanauk
column6: will be this leader. <Overlord Agmar hands you a parchment.> I give to you something familiar - the blood oath of the Horde. Take the oath to Roanauk Icemist and initiate him into the Horde as leader of the taunka. Let us not keep him waiting. <Agmar nods.>

column1: A Diplomatic Mission^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Counselor Talbot^Karuk^A Diplomatic Mission^Notify Arlos^^Speak to Karuk at Riplash Strand
column2: southwest of Valiance Keep.^I see that you are very eager to help
column3: <name>. You didn't come all the way to Northrend to stay holed up in a city! I've just the task for you... something that'll take you far away from here. We've long sought to gain the favor of the tuskarr native to Northrend. Recently a young tuskarr came to us seeking help
column4: something we couldn't offer at the time. Now that you're around
column5: maybe you can lend him a hand. Look for Karuk near the Riplash Strand
column6: southwest of here
column7: and see what you can do to help.

column1: Pest Control^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Duane^Duane^Pest Control^^^Duane at the 7th Legion Front wants you to kill 10 Snowplain Snobolds and 3 Dragonblight Magnataur at the magnataur camps surrounding Wyrmrest.^Ugh! One of those little snobold runts trashed our camp while we were busy with that last dragon. They've been plaguing us whenever we turn our backs... I've had enough! To the south you'll find the snobolds hiding under the skirts of some of the local magnataur. Go slaughter them. If the magnataur interfere on behalf of their slaves
column2: kill them as well.

column1: Canyon Chase^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Duane^Duane^Pest Control^^^Duane wants you to chase the snobolds down the canyon northeast of 7th Legion Front and deal with their leader.^I can't believe this! Another band of those vermin just tried to take off with more of our supplies. They're scurrying off towards that north canyon
column2: get after them and deal with whoever they're going to!

column1: Pest Control^73^Horde^Dragonblight^Kontokanis^Kontokanis^Pest Control^^^Kontokanis at Dragon's Fall wants you to kill 10 Snowplain Snobolds and 3 Dragonblight Magnataur at the magnataur camps surrounding Wyrmrest.^Oi
column2: mon! One of dose little snobold runts trashed our camp during da last dragon attack. Dey've been houndin us wheneva we turn our backs and I've had enough. To da east you'll find da snobolds hiding under da skirts of some of da local magnataur. Go slaughter dem. If da magnataur interfere on behalf of deir slaves
column3: kill dem as well.

column1: Canyon Chase^73^Horde^Dragonblight^Kontokanis^Kontokanis^Pest Control^^^Kontokanis wants you to chase the snobolds down the canyon south of Dragon's Fall and deal with their leader.^I can't believe dis! Another band of dose vermin just tried ta take off with more of our supplies. Dey're scurrying down da canyon now
column2: get after dem and deal with whoever dey're going to!

column1: Disturbing Implications^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Emblazoned Battle Horn^Aurastrasza^Disturbing Implications^^One of a Kind^Bring the Emblazoned Battle Horn to Wyrmrest and seek out someone who might be interested in assessing the potential threat.^The underside of the horn boasts an emblazoned seal with a hammer and a lightning bolt. Something about the horn seems extremely out of place on a Magnataur. Take the horn south down the Path of the Titans to Wyrmrest and seek out someone who might be interested in these threatening implications.

Disturbing Implications^73^Horde^Dragonblight^Emblazoned Battle Horn^Aurastrasza^Disturbing Implications^^One of a Kind^Bring the Emblazoned Battle Horn to Wyrmrest and seek out someone who might be interested in assessing the potential threat.^The underside of the horn boasts an emblazoned seal with a hammer and a lightning bolt. Something about the horn seems extremely out of place on a Magnataur. Take the horn east across the Dragon Wastes to Wyrmrest and seek out someone who might be interested in these threatening implications.

One of a Kind^73^All^Dragonblight^Aurastrasza^Aurastrasza^Disturbing Implications^^^Find and kill Bonesunder in or near the canyon northwest of the Azure Dragonshrine. Bring any evidence you find back to Aurastrasza at Wyrmrest Temple.^Such a strange seal to see among magnataur... it suggests an unusual amount of organization. Magnataur rarely put aside their aggressive natures to cooperate with each other. I suspect they have their eyes set on raiding a large settlement. I very much doubt that this horn is unique
column2: I need you to prove me wrong. In the canyon northwest of the Azure Dragonshrine you will find Bonesunder. Go challenge him and bring me back any evidence you find that might confirm my concerns.

column1: Mighty Magnataur^73^All^Dragonblight^Aurastrasza^Aurastrasza^Disturbing Implications^^^Hunt down and kill Bloodfeast
column2: Iceshatter
column3: and Drakegore east of Wyrmrest^Magnataur are hideously violent creatures... this is the main reason we rarely see them come together in any real numbers without killing each other. A powerful leader has stepped up somewhere among them and we need to hunt him down if we are to stop this threat. I will start asking around. I need you to disrupt them as much as possible in the meantime. East of here there are 3 torches erected. Near them
column4: there are 3 dominant Magnataur - put them down to buy us some time to hunt down this leader.

column1: Reclusive Runemaster^74^All^Dragonblight^Aurastrasza^Aurastrasza^Disturbing Implications^^^Locate Dregmar Runebrand near his cave on the path to the cliffs overlooking the Mirror of the Dawn. Challenge him and uncover the name of the magnataur leader by any means necessary. Return to Aurastrasza at Wyrmrest once the information is obtained.^Dregmar Runebrand is a magnataur runemaster... a rare breed. He's generally solitary
column2: but has been known to associate with the more powerful and influential magnataur in Dragonblight for quite some time. He will know who this new leader is. It is unlikely we will gain any aid with the increasing concerns with the Scourge and the blue flight
column3: so I need you to procure the information from Dregmar by any means necessary. I was told he can be found amongst the cliffs overlooking the Mirror of the Dawn.

column1: Wanton Warlord^74^All^Dragonblight^Aurastrasza^Aurastrasza^Disturbing Implications^^^Travel to the ring of torches south of the Azure Dragonshrine and blow the Emblazoned Battle Horn. Defeat Grom'thar the Thunderbringer and bring his head back to Aurastrasza at Wyrmrest.^There's no reason to suspect Dregmar's words are anything but true. Whether Grom'thar defeats you or is defeated by you
column2: he can wash his hands of this. Follow his instructions... take the horn that you brought me earlier
column3: travel to the ring of torches south of the Azure Dragonshrine
column4: and blow it to announce your challenge. When Grom'thar the Thunderbringer arrives
column5: kill him and bring me his head.

column1: Jin'arrak's End^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Kraz^Kraz^It Takes Guts....^^^Kraz at Harkor's Camp wants you to collect the Sacred Drakkari Offering from the Drakil'jin Ruins and use the Drakkari Spirit Dust on it. You must use the Infused Drakkari Offering at the gongs outside of Drakil'jin Ruins.^It is good to see you back among the living. Many who travel the path of the dead do not return to speak of it. While you were away
column2: a vision appeared to Kraz revealing what remains to be done. A sacred offering lies somewhere inside the crypt. Take this spirit dust fashioned from the remnants you collected and use it on the offering. The infused offering will bring an end to the corrupted warlord and will release the many tormented souls. May the spirits guide your actions
column3: <name>.

column1: The Iron Thane and His Anvil^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Raegar Breakbrow^Raegar Breakbrow^^... Or Maybe We Don't^^Using the abilities of your War Golem
column2: defeat Iron Thane Furyhammer
column3: then return to Raegar Breakbrow at Prospector's Point.^Now that you've charged up your war golem
column4: we're going to put all that energy to good use. Activate the golem inside Dun Argol to take control of it. Our information about Dun Argol's leader
column5: Iron Thane Furyhammer
column6: suggests his bodyguard protects him from all harm. That bodyguard is the construct he travels with
column7: called The Anvil. Disable the construct
column8: and his protection will disappear. The thane stays in the building at the top of Dun Argol and supervises production from the bottom level.

column1: Blackout^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Raegar Breakbrow^Raegar Breakbrow^^... Or Maybe We Don't^^Use Raegar's Explosives to destroy the Runic Power Core at Dun Argol
column2: then report to Raegar Breakbrow at Prospector's Point.^The large hall at the top of Dun Argol houses the power source for the entire area. If you can destroy the power core
column3: it will cripple Dun Argol for some time. No power means no golems
column4: no sentries
column5: and no more lightning armaments. When we were sent up here
column6: they told us these explosives were for excavation
column7: but thanks to Iron Thane Furyhammer
column8: the research has been scrapped. We may as well get some use out of them
column9: though. They're the only thing we have on hand capable of destroying the power core.

column1: The Lost Courier^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Private Casey^Courier Lanson^The Lost Courier^^^Speak to Courier Lanson at Star's Rest in Dragonblight.^We're lucky we made it this far
column2: <name>. We were ambushed by Scourge as soon as we landed. One of our men turned out to be a spy for the Cult of the Damned. Thassarian appears to have more evidence of cultist infiltration. Apparently it goes all the way to the top. I've sent one of my best couriers to our outpost in western Dragonblight
column3: but he has not yet returned. I fear he may have fallen to the Scourge. Will you go to Dragonblight and search for him? Courier Lanson is his name.

column1: Hollowstone Mine^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Captain Gryan Stoutmantle^Petrov^Descent into Darkness^^^Look for clues inside Hollowstone Mine northwest of the Westfall Brigade Encampment.^I've been meaning to send some of our lads to check out Hollowstone Mine. Haven't had a chance to yet -- we've had our hands full between the Horde on the west and the iron dwarves to the east. If Dumont sent you
column2: though
column3: the least I can do is point you in the right direction. You'll find the mine entrance to the northwest
column4: not far from here. See if you think operations there can be salvaged. We sure could use the additional resources until our mine in Farshire is operational again.

column1: Souls at Unrest^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Petrov^Petrov^Descent into Darkness^^^Petrov at Hollowstone Mine wants you to use the Miner's Lantern to burn the corpses of 8 Hollowstone Miners.^<Petrov looks deeply disturbed
column2: breathing heavily and shifting his gaze nervously around the mine.> My comrades... we must put their souls to rest! I kill them and kill them but.. they just come back! I've had an idea for a while but I just don't have the heart to do it myself. Maybe you can do this for me? Take this lantern and use its oil to burn their remains so they never get up again. I'll answer your questions later. Help my friends first!
