column1: A Name from the Past^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Petrov^Captain Gryan Stoutmantle^Descent into Darkness^^^Return to Captain Gryan Stoutmantle at the Westfall Brigade Encampment.^It worked! It worked! My comrades can finally enjoy their well-earned rest... I'll stay here and finish the job. We Hollowstone miners always finish the job -- we never give up! That's why Arugal made an example of us. We wouldn't fall in line
column2: you see? We wouldn't join his wolfcult!

column1: Ruuna the Blind^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Private Arun^Ruuna the Blind^Ruuna the Blind^^^Speak to Ruuna the Blind at Ruuna's Camp near Vordrassil Pass.^Hey there. I overheard what you were saying to the captain and I just want you to know... things aren't that simple in Northrend. Just because someone's dead it doesn't mean they're out of the picture. Southwest of here
column2: near Vordrassil Pass
column3: lives a blind woman who goes by the name Ruuna the Blind. They say she speaks to the dead and has visions of the past and future. I haven't heard your whole story but it sounds like she'd be right up your alley.

column1: Hour of the Worg^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Sasha^Sasha^^A Sister's Pledge^^Sasha at the White Pine Trading Post wants you to go to Bloodmoon Isle and slay Selas
column2: Varlam
column3: Goremaw and the Shade of Arugal.^It is time
column4: then
column5: <name>. Arugal must be defeated. Get a couple of people you can trust and head for Bloodmoon Isle. It's just off the coast
column6: east of here. We'll hit them fast. Take out Arugal's lieutenants -- I'll catch up with you when it's time to take out the monster himself.

column1: An Intriguing Plan^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Tormak the Scarred^Prospector Rokar^The Unexpected 'Guest'^^^Bring the completed War Golem Blueprints to Prospector Rokar at Camp Oneqwah.^Prospector Rokar has decided to help us. He's concocted a plan to use the iron dwarves' strength against them. I must admit
column2: our new 'friend' is more insightful than I'd given him credit for. He's correct in that our numbers are too few for a direct attack. Travel to Dun Argol
column3: in the snowy regions to the southeast
column4: and capture all the parts of their war golem blueprints from the iron rune-smiths there. Bring the assembled blueprint to Rokar and we'll see if his plan has any merit.

column1: The Liquid Fire of Elune^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Warden Jodi Moonsong^Warden Jodi Moonsong^The Liquid Fire of Elune^^^Warden Jodi Moonsong at Stars' Rest has asked you to use the Liquid Fire of Elune to cleanse the corpses of 6 Blighted Elk and 6 Rabid Grizzlies.^<race> will you assist me? The Scourge have moved into Icemist to the north. Wherever they go
column2: they spread their taint
column3: and the creatures of the land suffer. Take this vial
column4: which is filled with the liquid fire of Elune from the moonwell. Please
column5: use the liquid to cleanse the corpses of the blighted wildlife that you find.

column1: Kill the Cultists^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Warden Jodi Moonsong^Warden Jodi Moonsong^The Liquid Fire of Elune^^^Collect 5 Functional Cultist Suits for Warden Jodi Moonsong at Stars' Rest.^The Anub'ar cultists are indirectly responsible for the plaguing of the beasts
column2: and we must put an end to it! The fumes that emit from the cultists' suits seep into everything they come near
column3: poisoning and corrupting their surroundings. You must go north to Icemist Village and slay them. Bring back any of their suits that survive your assault and I will see to it that they are properly disposed of.

column1: The Favor of Zangus^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^The Favor of Zangus^Warden Jodi Moonsong^The Favor of Zangus^^^Deliver the Favor of Zangus to Warden Jodi Moonsong at Stars' Rest.^An inscription on the back of the favor reads
column2: "To my favorite pupil
column3: If you continue to show promise
column4: I will teach you wonders beyond your imaginings. If you do not
column5: I will have you destroyed! As ever
column6: High Cultist Zangus" No doubt the warden at Stars' Rest will want to see this.

column1: The High Cultist^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Warden Jodi Moonsong^Warden Jodi Moonsong^The Favor of Zangus^^^Warden Jodi Moonsong at Stars' Rest has asked you to slay High Cultist Zangus.^I have dreamed of Zangus before but without the context that you have discovered
column2: I knew not what it meant. You have brought clarity to the vision that the goddess has bestowed upon me
column3: and now I know that he can be found within the Pit of Narjun to the north. You know your target
column4: <name>. If there's to be an end to the suffering of the land
column5: the high cultist must die!

column1: Blackriver Brawl^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Raider Captain Kronn^Raider Captain Kronn^^^^Raider Captain Kronn wants you to slay 10 Alliance units or players at the Blackriver Logging Camp.^The Venture Company abandoned operations shortly after we showed up. Clearly they were afraid of what we were going to do to their greedy little hides. With them gone
column2: their logging camps are up for grabs. Our war machine is a hungry beast... without renewing our supplies we won't make it to Icecrown. Unfortunately the Alliance seems to have the same idea and we must make sure we're the ones that prevail. Head into the logging camp and help us fight the Alliance scum.

column1: Of Traitors and Treason^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Courier Lanson^Palena Silvercloud^The Lost Courier^^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^Show the Alliance Missive to Palena Silvercloud at Stars' Rest.^The list I hold must be delivered to High Commander Halford Wyrmbane. He commands the 7th Legion
column2: stationed at Wintergarde Keep on the eastern borders of Dragonblight. If any of the traitors on this list are stationed at Wintergarde... it could be catastrophic. Hurry
column3: <name>. Show the document to Palena Silvercloud here at Stars' Rest and explain the nature of your mission. She will put you on her fastest hippogryph to Wintergarde!

column1: Attunement to Dalaran^73^Alliance^Mage^Image of Archmage Modera^Image of Archmage Modera^^^^The Image of Archmage Modera at Stars' Rest has asked you to become Attuned to the Ley Lines of Northrend.^Welcome
column2: mage. By now you must be wondering where Dalaran is and how to get there. I will help you. But before I can teach you how to teleport to our great city
column3: you must attune yourself to the ley lines of Northrend. Otherwise
column4: you risk destroying yourself in the process. Take this attunement crystal and use it in the pit under the surge needle at the Moonrest Gardens to the west. Then you will be ready to learn the spell.

column1: Attunement to Dalaran^73^Horde^Mage^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^^^^The Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver at Agmar's Hammer has asked you to become Attuned to the Ley Lines of Northrend.^Hello
column2: mage. By now you must be wondering where Dalaran is and how to get there. I can help you with this if you can survive a simple test. Before I teach you how to teleport to our great city
column3: you must attune yourself to the ley lines of Northrend. Otherwise
column4: you will destroy yourself in the process! Take this attunement crystal and use it in the pit under the surge needle at the Moonrest Gardens to the southwest. Then you will be ready to learn what I have to teach.

column1: High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Palena Silvercloud^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^The Lost Courier^^^Deliver the Alliance Missive to High Commander Halford Wyrmbane at Wintergarde Keep in eastern Dragonblight.^<Palena hands the missive back to you.> Snowstorm will take you to Wintergarde
column2: <name>. I guarantee you that it will be the fastest flight you've ever taken. Go now!

column1: Gray Worg Hides^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Hidetrader Jun'ik^Hidetrader Jun'ik^Gray Worg Hides^^^Hidetrader Jun'ik in Conquest Hold wants you to get 3 Gray Worg Hides from Graymist Hunters in the woods to the north.^Let me tell you something
column2: mon. When you get put in charge of outfittin' the armies of the Horde
column3: you go through a lot of hides! Conqueror Krenna
column4: the she-wolf runnin' this place
column5: she gave me a tight deadline. If I don't outfit her whole regiment by week's end she's gonna have me wrestling bears in the pit. Help me out and I'll pay you top price. I'll be needin' hides from graymist hunters. You'll find them all around in pockets to the north
column6: hunting stag. Remember
column7: mon. Top price!

column1: A Minor Substitution^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Hidetrader Jun'ik^Hidetrader Jun'ik^Gray Worg Hides^^^Hidetrader Jun'ik wants you to bring him 6 Grizzly Hides.^Krenna
column2: she be wantin' worg hides for all the outfits. There's not gonna be enough worg hides for her army
column3: though. Not now
column4: not ever. Those worgs -- they be skinny
column5: mon! Here's what we're gonna do... if you can keep a secret that is. East of Voldrune there be grizzly bears as fat as an ogre. Those large hides -- those we can use! Hurry
column6: <brother/sister>. Krenna's not known for her patience.

column1: Jun'ik's Coverup^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Hidetrader Jun'ik^Hidetrader Jun'ik^Gray Worg Hides^^^Bring 1 piece of Coal and 5 Simple Flour to Hidetrader Jun'ik at Conquest Hold in Grizzly Hills.^Ah
column2: we have a small problem. Grizzly hides... they be brown
column3: mon! Think... think! I got it
column4: mon! Is like this: gray is black an' white all mixed up. You get me some coal an' some flour
column5: I'll grind it all up and dust the hides with it. No one will know the better! Blacksmiths sell coal for smeltin' an' you can get flour from the provisioner.

column1: Delivery to Krenna^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Hidetrader Jun'ik^Conqueror Krenna^Gray Worg Hides^^The Conquest Pit: Bear Wrestling!^Take the Bundle of Hides to Krenna in Conquest Hold.^This is it
column2: mon. Let's take these hides to Krenna and see if they pass the test. Let's hope for both our sakes Krenna doesn't notice anything.

column1: The Captive Prospectors^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Mountaineer Kilian^Mountaineer Kilian^^The Runic Prophecies^Looking the Part^Free Prospector Gann
column2: Prospector Torgan
column3: and Prospector Varana
column4: then return to Mountaineer Kilian at Prospector's Point.^Raegar sent a team of prospectors into Dun Argol to search for artifacts and information about the history of the settlement. Raegar's team never expected Dun Argol to be this heavily populated. They're being held captive while the iron dwarves prepare for war. We haven't the men to charge in after them
column5: and Raegar's too busy fantasizing about defeating the irons to be of much help. It falls to you
column6: <name>. Any of the irons or their servants could be carrying the keys to the cages holding our men.

column1: Give it a Name^72^Horde^Howling Fjord^Chief Plaguebringer Harris^Tobias Sarkhoff^Give it a Name^^^Show the Blight Specimen to Tobias Sarkhoff at New Agamand.^My
column2: my
column3: how long has it been? How long have we been working on this damned plague? Finally
column4: after an eternity of failure
column5: we are blessed with perfection. This... It doesn't even have a proper name yet! This blight... That's it
column6: BLIGHT! This blight will tear down the very fabric of life! <Harris hands you a vial.> Now
column7: find the bat handler
column8: Tobias
column9: and show him the specimen. He'll get you on your way to Venomspite.

column1: To Venomspite!^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Tobias Sarkhoff^Chief Plaguebringer Middleton^Give it a Name^^^Deliver the Blight Specimen to Chief Plaguebringer Middleton at Venomspite in eastern Dragonblight.^I got a special bat all lined up for you
column2: buddy. Fastest and smoothest ride I've got. He'll take you right to Venomspite - in style. Just hand that vial over to Chief Plaguebringer Middleton once you land.

column1: Looking the Part^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Mountaineer Kilian^Mountaineer Kilian^Looking the Part^The Captive Prospectors^^Bring an Overseer's Uniform to Mountaineer Kilian at Prospector's Point.^If
column2: as Prospector Varana said
column3: only certain irons are permitted to communicate with this Loken
column4: it'll probably be the overseers who have the privilege. We have to get you in there to see what all this is about
column5: but it won't be easy. The first step will be to get a proper uniform for you. Then
column6: we'll worry about doing your makeup. Find one of the overseers at Dun Argol
column7: kill him
column8: and bring back his uniform. If you get blood on it
column9: you'll have only yourself to blame.

column1: Cultivating an Image^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Mountaineer Kilian^Mountaineer Kilian^Looking the Part^^^Use Kilian's Camera to record the images of 8 Iron Dwarves in Dun Argol
column2: then return to Mountaineer Kilian at Prospector's Point.^Now that we've got the uniform
column3: we've got to get enough information to complete your camouflage. Raegar brought along this camera to document the team's finds
column4: but I have a different use in mind. I want you to take it with you to Dun Argol and use it to capture the images of iron dwarves. Of course
column5: your models aren't going to be a cooperative lot
column6: so you may have to
column7: err... subdue them first. Bring back the camera and the images when you're done.

column1: Put on Your Best Face for Loken^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Mountaineer Kilian^Mountaineer Kilian^Looking the Part^^^Disguise yourself as an Iron Rune Overseer
column2: intercept the message from Loken
column3: then report to Mountaineer Kilian at Prospector's Point.^Using the images you've captured
column4: I've created everything you need for your overseer disguise kit. You'll make a fine iron dwarf
column5: if I do say so myself. Take the kit with you to Dun Argol
column6: use it to disguise yourself
column7: then go to the easternmost building on the broad middle tier of the city. There
column8: you should see a pedestal where the thane and overseers receive their orders from this Loken. Activate it while disguised and learn all you can from the communication.

column1: The Forsaken Blight and You: How Not to Die^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Chief Plaguebringer Middleton^Chief Plaguebringer Middleton^Give it a Name^^^Chief Plaguebringer Middleton at Venomspite in Dragonblight wants you to bring him 10 Ectoplasmic Residue.^The details behind the functionality of the blight are hardly important. All you need to know is that it does the job it was designed to do. I have managed to synthesize a strain of the blight that is inert. <Middleton uncorks a vial and inhales.> See
column2: my body is still
column3: mostly
column4: intact. Now mix this with a reactive agent and we'd all be turned to shapeless piles of goo. On the beach south of here you will find pathetic specters of Alliance soldiers past. Slay them and bring me ectoplasmic residue.

column1: Imbeciles Abound!^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Doctor Sintar Malefious^Chief Plaguebringer Middleton^Imbeciles Abound!^^^Travel to Venomspite in Dragonblight and speak with Chief Plaguebringer Middleton.^The shipment from New Agamand was to arrive at Venomspite last week and then be delivered to me after some simple field tests. It is a Horde imperative - the last piece of the "victory puzzle." <Sintar sighs.> It is quite disheartening to know that you are surrounded by imbeciles and incompetent boobs! You must travel to Venomspite
column2: near the eastern border of Dragonblight. Find that buffoon
column3: Middleton
column4: and let him know that I am waiting on the package.

column1: Say Hello to My Little Friend^74^All^Grizzly Hills^Prigmon^Harkor^Shimmercap Stew^^^Prigmon wants you to bring Harkor's Ingredients to Harkor at Harkor's Camp.^Harkor's gunna drop a gold brick when he sees these choice ingredients. All that be left is gettin' them to him. He's camped out on the eastern coast near dem haunted ruins - Drakil'jin
column2: dey be called. You'll likely be makin' it there before I can finish up with these corpses... unless
column3: ya think you'd rather try your hand at embalming?

column1: The Unexpected 'Guest'^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Tormak the Scarred^Tormak the Scarred^The Unexpected 'Guest'^^From the Ground Up^Bring 5 Mature Stag Horns to Tormak the Scarred at Camp Oneqwah.^A recent hunting expedition brought back more than just game. They encountered a wounded dwarf fleeing the iron dwarf stronghold of Dun Argol. He may have information we can use to strike at our ancient enemy
column2: but before he's of any use to us
column3: we must bring down his fever. The horns of the silvercoat stags
column4: who roam the nearby forest
column5: have long been used to make healing poultices. If you can bring enough of the horns to me
column6: we'll see if the poultice can bring our 'guest' around.

column1: From the Ground Up^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Prospector Rokar^Prospector Rokar^The Unexpected 'Guest'^The Unexpected 'Guest'^^Bring 8 War Golem Parts to Prospector Rokar at Camp Oneqwah.^We don't have enough time for me to forge the parts myself
column2: but the foundries over at Dun Argol
column3: to the southeast
column4: are working day and night to churn out golem parts. I think you should go back there and pick up enough of them for me to make a golem from this blueprint. They're probably scattered around any of the buildings where the iron rune-smiths are working. Please hurry
column5: <name>. That Tormak looks like he's just waiting for an excuse to carry out his threat!

column1: We Have the Power^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Prospector Rokar^Prospector Rokar^The Unexpected 'Guest'^^^Bring Durar's Power Cell and Kathorn's Power Cell to Prospector Rokar at Camp Oneqwah.^Well
column2: we've got the shell of a golem
column3: but that's not good enough for Tormak. He doesn't realize that these things don't just come together and miraculously start working! We're going to need power cells to animate it. When I was in Dun Argol
column4: I noticed that Rune-Smith Durar and Rune-Smith Kathorn were the ones who manufactured the cells. We'll need one from each to power our golem. You should be able to find each rune-smith in his workshop on the central level of Dun Argol.

column1: ... Or Maybe We Don't^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Prospector Rokar^Prospector Rokar^The Unexpected 'Guest'^^^Charge your War Golem with the energy from 10 Lightning Sentries and return to Prospector Rokar at Camp Oneqwah.^The golem's cells have just enough power to run it at the lowest levels
column2: but it can't power any of its combat systems. The good news is that the perimeter of Dun Argol is patrolled by lightning sentries. We should be able to use their power to charge up the golem's weapon systems. Bring the golem with you
column3: take it close to them
column4: it will absorb the power as the sentries die.

column1: Bringing Down the Iron Thane^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Prospector Rokar^Tormak the Scarred^The Unexpected 'Guest'^^^Using the abilities of your War Golem
column2: defeat Iron Thane Furyhammer
column3: then return to Tormak the Scarred at Camp Oneqwah.^Now that the golem is fully charged
column4: it can be used against the leader at Dun Argol. When I observed Iron Thane Furyhammer
column5: he was always guarded by a personal golem that shielded him from all harm. That construct called The Anvil
column6: can be disrupted
column7: causing him to drop the shield. Use your golem's EMP ability to do just that. You'll be able to activate and take control of your golem inside Dun Argol. The thane is in the main plant at the top and supervises production from the bottom level.

column1: Emerald Dragon Tears^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Chief Plaguebringer Middleton^Chief Plaguebringer Middleton^Give it a Name^^^Chief Plaguebringer Middleton at Venomspite in Dragonblight wants you to collect 8 Emerald Dragon Tears.^With an inert specimen of the blight compound complete and the activating agent in hand there only remains a need for a suitable shell to house the components. Southwest of here
column2: on the shores of central Dragonblight
column3: is where you will find the Emerald Dragonshrine. Within the shrine you will find the hardened remnants of a green dragon's tear drop. I don't know the whole story
column4: but apparently they cry a lot right before they die. Go figure. Go to the Emerald Dragonshrine and gather tears.

column1: The Overseer's Shadow^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Scout Vor'takh^Scout Vor'takh^The Runic Prophecies^^^Bring an Overseer's Uniform to Scout Vor'takh at Camp Oneqwah.^It sounds like this Loken is the mastermind behind the sudden preparations for war on the part of the iron dwarves. Only the highest ranking irons are likely to have access to him
column2: so we'll have to make you into an overseer to find out what's going on in there. I have a plan
column3: for that
column4: but we'll need some supplies. Find one of the iron rune overseers at Dun Argol
column5: to the southeast
column6: kill him
column7: and bring back his uniform.

column1: Cultivating an Image^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Scout Vor'takh^Scout Vor'takh^The Runic Prophecies^^^Use Rokar's Camera to record the images of 8 Iron Dwarves in Dun Argol
column2: then return to Scout Vor'takh at Camp Oneqwah.^Now we have to finish the job of making you as repulsive as those iron dwarves. The best way to do that is to base your disguise on the ugly mugs of real iron dwarves. When Tormak's hunting party discovered that wayward prospector
column3: they took the camera he carried. Now
column4: I suppose
column5: we'll get the chance to use it. Take it with you to Dun Argol
column6: kill some iron dwarves
column7: and record their likenesses in this device. Bring it back once you have enough examples.

column1: Loken's Orders^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Scout Vor'takh^Scout Vor'takh^The Runic Prophecies^^^Disguise yourself as an Iron Rune Overseer
column2: intercept the message from Loken
column3: then report to Scout Vor'takh at Camp Oneqwah.^I've created everything else you'll need for your overseer disguise kit. Try not to retch when you put it on. I took pains to make it as true to reality as possible. Take the kit with you southeast to Dun Argol
column4: use it to disguise yourself
column5: then go to the easternmost building on the broad middle tier of the city. There
column6: you should see a pedestal where the thane and overseers receive their orders from this Loken. Activate it while disguised and learn all you can from the communication.

column1: In the Name of Loken^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Scout Vor'takh^Scout Vor'takh^The Runic Prophecies^The Runic Prophecies
column2: Pounding the Iron^^Speak with Hugh Glass and Gavrock about Loken
column3: then report your findings to Scout Vor'takh at Camp Oneqeah.^The iron dwarves stand as one of the fiercest and most coordinated foes in Northrend. Wherever we have traveled
column4: they have battled us with the name of Loken on their lips. We must learn who this Loken is and what he seeks. The locals may be of help. To the northeast
column5: at the Redwood Trading Post
column6: a human named Hugh Glass peddles his wares. Further east
column7: at the Ruins of Tethys
column8: you'll find a stone giant named Gavrock. Ask them about this Loken. They've got to know something of use.

column1: Wanted: The Scarlet Onslaught^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Wanted Poster^High Executor Wroth^^^^Kill 20 members of the Scarlet Onslaught and report to High Executor Wroth at Venomspite.^By order of High Executor Wroth all members of the illegal organization known as the Scarlet Onslaught are to be put to death immediately. No quarter is to be offered
column2: and those proceeding to action upon this decree should be aware that any who are captured by the humans will be left to die
column3: or worse! In the High Executor's words
column4: "Paint the snow red with their blood!"

column1: Blighted Last Rites^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Apothecary Vicky Levine^Apothecary Vicky Levine^^^^Apothecary Vicky Levine at Venomspite has asked you to test the Flask of Blight upon the Scarlet Onslaught Prisoner.^Have you read the wanted poster? What is the high executor thinking?! <Vicky looks around and continues in hushed tones.> We can't very well have those Scarlet Onslaught idiots being raised by their priests
column2: or worse
column3: rising as the Scourge
column4: now can we? No
column5: I'm in total agreement with you
column6: we have to do something about the corpses. I have just the thing. Take this blight that we just created and test it on the prisoner in the cage right here. No muss
column7: no fuss
column8: no returning enemies.

column1: Vordrassil's Fall^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Windseer Grayhorn^Windseer Grayhorn^^Attack on Silverbrook^^Windseer Grayhorn in Conquest Hold wants you to go to Vordrassil's Limb
column2: Vordrassil's Heart or Vordrassil's Tears and obtain 6 Slime Samples from the Entropic Oozes.^Long ago
column3: powerful druids planted a tree to the northeast of here. It was called Vordrassil and it was to be a world tree. It is not known why
column4: but after the tree was fully grown
column5: the druids decided it needed to be destroyed. Ever since we arrived here
column6: the earth has spoken to me
column7: <name>. Its cries of pain come from the places where Vordrassil's remains fell on the ground. Corrupting ooze roams those places. Bring me samples of it so we may begin to heal the land.

column1: Good Troll Hunting^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Sergeant Thurkin^Samir^Good Troll Hunting^^^Sergeant Thurkin told you to speak to Samir at Granite Springs.^Good for nothing wretches! They could have had it easy. We extended our hand in peace. All they had to do was give us passage through Drak'Tharon and we'd have let them be. But no
column2: the prideful little ice trolls decided that they wanted it rough. Now they'll be destroyed and we'll pass through their precious keep to Zul'Drak anyway. We've contracted a gang to deliver us captured trolls. Talk to Samir if you want in on the action. You can find him to the northwest of here
column3: due south of Zeb'Halek.

column1: Materiel Plunder^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Quartermaster Bartlett^Quartermaster Bartlett^^^^Quartermaster Bartlett at Venomspite has asked you to steal 8 Scarlet Onslaught Armor and 8 Scarlet Onslaught Weapons.^Ah good
column2: new meat. Do you wish to prove yourself
column3: new meat? The Scarlet Onslaught
column4: the most zealous and racist of the Scarlet Crusade
column5: are in our backyard to the south. If we're going to fight them
column6: we'll need more armor and weapons than I can make in such a short time. Why don't we take theirs? More to the point
column7: why don't YOU take theirs?

column1: Troll Season!^73^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Lieutenant Dumont^Samir^Troll Season!^^^Lieutenant Dumont at Amberpine Lodge wants you to speak to Samir at Granite Springs.^You
column2: <race>! No sense standing around here when there's work to be done! Drak'Theron Keep is the most direct route to Zul'Drak. We MUST capture it to ensure safe passage for the Alliance. But until we get the numbers to make an assault
column3: we'll have to content ourselves in thinning out the ice trolls and collecting intel. To that end
column4: we've conscripted a gang of thugs to capture and deliver live trolls for interrogation. Travel northwest and speak with Samir at Granite Springs. He'll direct you further.

column1: Let Them Not Rise!^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Apothecary Vicky Levine^Apothecary Vicky Levine^^^^Apothecary Vicky Levine at Venomspite has asked you to use her Container of Rats to pick clean the corpses of 15 Scarlet Onslaught members at New Hearthglen.^I don't understand it. The blight should have worked! No sense worrying about it now. <The apothecary seems relieved for some reason.> Though it doesn't work on the Onslaught for some strange reason
column2: we still need to keep their priests from raising them. I have another idea
column3: one that their corpses shouldn't have any protection from. <name>
column4: take a container of my rats and unleash them upon any Onslaught corpses you come across at New Hearthglen. I starve the vermin
column5: so they should be voracious!

column1: Replenishing the Storehouse^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Master Woodsman Anderhol^Master Woodsman Anderhol^Replenishing the Storehouse^^^Master Woodsman Anderhol at Amberpine Lodge wants you to kill Tallhorn Stag and collect 8 Succulent Venison.^G'day
column2: <class>. The good lieutenant here says that there's been a Horde raid on our storehouse that's left our food supply dangerously low. No doubt we'll make those cretins pay
column3: but first we need to focus our attention on restocking. My men are doing all they can
column4: but we're going to need every able body to contribute if we're to avert a crisis. You should have no trouble harvesting venison from the local stag in these parts. Happy hunting!

column1: The Darkness Beneath^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Windseer Grayhorn^Windseer Grayhorn^^Attack on Silverbrook^^Windseer Grayhorn in Conquest Hold wants you to go to Vordrassil's Heart
column2: Vordrassil's Tears and Vordrassil's Limb and use the Geomancer's Orb in the depths beneath the surface.^Something... dark... happened to the tree Vordrassil. After the druids decided to destroy it
column3: its hollow remains grew roots deep into the ground. I want you to go to the three locations to the northeast where the tree's trunk shattered and go as far beneath the ground as you can. Use this orb once you get there to get an imprint of the energy surrounding the area. This might shed some light on what happened to Vordrassil and why it failed to become a world tree.

column1: Fresh Remounts^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Hansel Bauer^Hansel Bauer^^^^Hansel Bauer at Venomspite has asked you to steal 3 Onslaught Warhorses and deliver them to him
column2: handing over the reins when you do so.^Hello. I am Hansel. Pleased to meet you
column3: <sir /ma'am>. The high executor came to me and said
column4: 'Hansel
column5: I want you to get us new mounts.' Where does he think dreadsteeds come from? The ground? Actually
column6: they do if you can find a horse graveyard. But we don't have one of those
column7: so what we need you to do is go south to New Hearthglen
column8: kill the knights
column9: take their riding crops
column10: and steal their warhorses. Ride the horse back to me here and hand over the reins
column11: if you would.

column1: Them or Us!^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Master Woodsman Anderhol^Master Woodsman Anderhol^Them or Us!^^^Anderhol at Amberpine Lodge wants you to find and kill 6 Graymist Hunters in Grizzly Hills.^As if we didn't have enough to concern ourselves with.... With the present food crisis
column2: we find ourselves competing for food with the local worgs. The situation is becoming more dire
column3: and I fear that if we don't address the issue immediately we'll soon find ourselves with nothing to hunt. Scour the forest
column4: <race>. Kill any graymist you find. Recent reports have sighted a concentration of them on the other side of the river west of here.

column1: Take Their Rear!^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Master Woodsman Anderhol^Master Woodsman Anderhol^Replenishing the Storehouse^^^Anderhol at Amberpine Lodge wants you to collect 8 Grizzly Flanks from the Grizzly Bears in Grizzly Hills.^We've all been working hard and it's beginning to pay off
column2: but we're still far from our goal. We need much more meat than we have and it's growing clear that the local stag population won't be enough by itself. I'm afraid we need you to turn your attention to more dangerous prey - the grizzlies that give this region its name. They're plentiful
column3: and they're well fed from the abundant fish that swim in these streams. Be safe
column4: <class>!

column1: Eagle Eyes^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Master Woodsman Anderhol^Master Woodsman Anderhol^Them or Us!^^^Anderhol in Amberpine Lodge wants you to kill 5 Imperial Eagles and then report back to him.^Well
column2: <name>
column3: we've determined how the Horde was able to locate our hidden stores of food. It turns out that they were binding their sight to the unsuspecting eagles that soar above the trees here. Using eagle vision
column4: they were able to effectively spy on our every action. By order of the lieutenant
column5: we've got to hunt down these majestic birds in order to thwart our enemy.

column1: Spread the Good Word^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Chief Plaguebringer Middleton^Chief Plaguebringer Middleton^Give it a Name^^^Chief Plaguebringer Middleton at Venomspite in Dragonblight wants you to use the Forsaken Blight Spreader's Blight Bomb to destroy 30 Hungering Dead on the outskirts of the Carrion Fields.^Before I can ship you off to Doctor Malefious with the good news
column2: you will have to run a simple field test of the blight with the modifications I have made. The hungering dead stream out from what remains of Old Wintergarde. Commandeer a vehicle from the east gate and drive it northeast through Vengeance Pass until you reach the twin towers at the southeastern edge of Wintergarde. Drop the blight bomb on the undead that cover the area. Report back to me with the results!

column1: The Failed World Tree^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Hierophant Thayreen^Hierophant Thayreen^^A Swift Response^Children of Ursoc^Hierophant Thayreen at Amberpine Lodge wants you to go to Vordrassil's Limb
column2: Vordrassil's Heart or Vordrassil's Tears and obtain 6 Slime Samples from the Entropic Oozes.^My ancestors once planted a tree in the middle of the Grizzly Hills. It was called Vordrassil and it was to become a world tree. For reasons long forgotten
column3: after the tree was fully grown
column4: they decided it needed to be destroyed. Its giant trunk splintered at three locations in the area to the north. Where the tree touched the ground
column5: foul ooze began to crawl the earth. Bring me slime samples so I can begin my work and the earth can be healed.

column1: A Dark Influence^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Hierophant Thayreen^Hierophant Thayreen^^A Swift Response^A Possible Link^Hierophant Thayreen at Amberpine Lodge wants you to go to Vordrassil's Heart
column2: Vordrassil's Tears and Vordrassil's Limb and use the Geomancer's Orb in the depths beneath the surface.^When the tree Vordrassil fell
column3: its hollow remains grew roots deep into the ground. I want you to go north of here to the three locations where the trunk shattered and go as far beneath the ground as you can. You'll find them west of Grizzlemaw. Use this orb once you get there to get an imprint of the energy surrounding the area. If we're to heal the land
column4: we must first find out what caused Vordrassil to fail as a world tree all those years ago.

column1: The Forsaken Blight^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Chief Plaguebringer Middleton^Doctor Sintar Malefious^Give it a Name^^The Kor'kron Vanguard!^Deliver The Forsaken Blight to Doctor Sintar Malefious at Agmar's Hammer.^I have prepared a package that must be delivered to Doctor Sintar Malefious at Agmar's Hammer. The contents of the package include the final blight specimen along with instructions on preparation and samples of the reactive agent. You will find Agmar's Hammer in western Dragonblight. Just look for the black
column2: jagged metal orc buildings - that will be Agmar's Hammer.

column1: Secrets of the Flamebinders^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Woodsman Drake^Woodsman Drake^Secrets of the Flamebinders^A Tentative Pact^Mmm... Amberseeds!^Bring 3 Flame-Imbued Talismans to Woodsman Drake at Amberpine Lodge.^Even as we attempt to fight off the Horde
column2: the Dragonflayer tribe musters in their village of Voldrune
column3: near the coast to the south. The most powerful warriors in the village are granted flame-imbued talismans that give them the ability to control powerful
column4: savage proto-drakes. If we can gain control of one of these drakes
column5: perhaps we can use it to neutralize the threat posed by Voldrune. The Dragonflayer flamebinders create the talismans and imbue them with power. Kill them and take the talismans.

column1: Thinning the Ranks^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Woodsman Drake^Woodsman Drake^Thinning the Ranks^A Tentative Pact^Mmm... Amberseeds!^Kill 12 Dragonflayer Huscarls and return to Woodsman Drake at Amberpine Lodge.^There's a flurry of activity down in Voldrune village to the south. Thane Torvald Eriksson and his huscarls are preparing for war. With most of our men in the field dealing with the Horde's treachery
column2: Amberpine will be vulnerable. Travel to Voldrune
column3: which is near the southern coast
column4: and show those Dragonflayers we're no soft target. Slay as many of the huscarls as you can find. Make them think twice about taking advantage of our conflict with the Horde.

column1: The Kor'kron Vanguard!^73^Horde^Dragonblight^Overlord Agmar^Saurfang the Younger^The Kor'kron Vanguard!^Agmar's Hammer
column2: Blightbeasts be Damned!
column3: All Hail Roanauk!
column4: The Forsaken Blight^^Report to Saurfang the Younger at the Kor'kron Vanguard.^You have done well
column5: <brother/sister>. All that you have faced
column6: you have done as a champion of the Horde. The Scourged Anub'ar of Azjol-Nerub
column7: crushed under your foot! The taunka
column8: brave and powerful new members of the Horde
column9: because of you! Our super-weapon against the Scourge
column10: tested and perfected by you! The time has come
column11: the moment is now - our elite soldiers at the Wrathgate need you. The son of Saurfang awaits your arrival at the Kor'kron Vanguard. Go now
column12: northeast to the Wrathgate.

column1: Mmm... Amberseeds!^73^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Amberseed^Master Woodsman Anderhol^Mmm... Amberseeds!^Secrets of the Flamebinders
column2: Thinning the Ranks^^Speak with Master Woodsman Anderhol in Amberpine Lodge.^Your stomach growls as the pungent smell of hearty nuts draws your attention to the the bucket of seeds. Some thoughtful soul has obviously left these complimentary morsels here to rejuvenate weary visitors. Grateful
column3: you take the remaining few and devour them. The seeds do not disappoint. Finding yourself hungry for more
column4: you set out to discover their origins....

column1: Just Passing Through^73^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Master Woodsman Anderhol^Master Woodsman Anderhol^Mmm... Amberseeds!^^^Anderhol at Amberpine Lodge wants you to bring him 5 Blackroot Stalks.^We must act quickly
column2: <race>! We can't risk letting those precious seeds become fully digested. They need to come out
column3: NOW. Forage up some blackroot from the riverbank just west of here and I'll make you a purgative that should get things moving. Hurry now! And remember
column4: you brought this upon yourself....

column1: Doing Your Duty^73^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Master Woodsman Anderhol^Master Woodsman Anderhol^Mmm... Amberseeds!^^^Anderhol in Amberpine Lodge wants you to take the Anderhol's Slider Cider and use the nearby outhouse to retrieve the Partially Processed Amberseeds.^Alright
column2: <race>. Here's the juice. It works immediately
column3: so don't use it until you're safely inside the outhouse. Now go get me those seeds!

column1: A Possible Link^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Windseer Grayhorn^Windseer Grayhorn^^^^Windseer Grayhorn in Conquest Hold wants you to obtain 8 Crazed Furbolg Blood from the Furbolgs at Heart's Blood Shrine and Rage Fang Shrine.^Not long ago we sent an expedition to the east
column2: where it was attacked by crazed furbolgs. One of the survivors described slaying one of them and its body expelling a dark slimy substance. For thousands of years
column3: the furbolgs in this region have been peaceful. It is possible that there is a link to the furbolgs' behavior and the dark energy we were able to detect earlier. Bring me samples of the furbolgs' blood. You will find them to the east in the Rage Fang Shrine and the Heart's Blood Shrine.

column1: Stealing from the Siegesmiths^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Deathguard Molder^Deathguard Molder^Stealing from the Siegesmiths^^^Deathguard Molder at Venomspite has asked you to retrieve 6 Siegesmith Bombs.^I'm tasked with the destruction of the Scarlet Onslaught's ballistae. Unfortunately
column2: the apothecaries and I are at odds on the use of our resources
column3: so I've nothing to destroy them with! To the northeast are the Carrion Fields. The Scourge siegesmiths there at their forge and meat wagons are demolition masters. Luckily for us
column4: they also leave their bombs lying about. I want you to retrieve them for me
column5: off of the ground or the siegesmiths
column6: I don't care which.

column1: The Bear God's Offspring^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Windseer Grayhorn^Windseer Grayhorn^^^^Windseer Grayhorn in Conquest Hold wants you to speak to Orsonn at the Ragefang Shrine and Kodian at the Heart's Blood Shrine.^It is possible that the furbolg of Grizzly Hills have the same taint that plagued Vordrassil. They've been involved in a deadly tribal war recently after years of peaceful coexistence. The shrines that they guard to the east are home to Ursoc's offspring. If the corruption has affected the furbolg
column2: it is possible that because of their lineage
column3: Kodian and Orsonn have remained unharmed. If that's the case
column4: find them and listen to what they have to say.

column1: Bombard the Ballistae^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Deathguard Molder^Deathguard Molder^Stealing from the Siegesmiths^^^Deathguard Molder at Venomspite has asked you to use the Siegesmith Bombs to bombard 5 New Hearthglen Ballistae.^At last
column2: our chance to strike at their siege engines! Don't flub it. I kid. A little. <class>
column3: bombard New Hearthglen's ballistae with these bombs. We'll show the Royal Apothecary Society how it's done old style. No concoctions required!

column1: Need to Know^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Spy Mistress Repine^Spy Mistress Repine^Need to Know^^^Spy Mistress Repine at Venomspite has asked you to steal the Scarlet Onslaught Daily Orders: Abbey
column2: Scarlet Onslaught Daily Orders: Barracks
column3: and Scarlet Onslaught Daily Orders: Beach.^I need to know what New Hearthglen is up to. I want you to steal their orders of the day so that I can find that out. Head south and in their abbey
column4: in their barracks
column5: and on their beach
column6: find those daily plans! Just in case you're confused
column7: the barracks is the large building right next to the smithy.

column1: Naxxramas and the Fall of Wintergarde^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^Gryphon Commander Urik^The Lost Courier^^^Speak with Gryphon Commander Urik at the gryphon station in Wintergarde Keep.^Lord Fordragon has led a crushing assault against Arthas at the Wrathgate. In response to this affront
column2: Arthas has sent Naxxramas down upon us. While Kel'Thuzad hides in the floating citadel
column3: his ground commander
column4: Thel'zan
column5: lays siege to Wintergarde Keep. The lower village is already lost and any chance of extracting survivors from the ruins diminishes by the minute. We must act quickly! Report to Gryphon Commander Urik at the gryphon station at once! He'll get you up to speed. Leave me!

column1: Ursoc
column2: the Bear God^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Windseer Grayhorn^Windseer Grayhorn^Destroy the Sapling^Destroy the Sapling
column3: Vordrassil's Seeds^^Windseer Grayhorn in Conquest Hold wants you to find Tur Ragepaw near Ursoc's Den and defeat Ursoc with his help. Use the Purified Ashes of Vordrassil on Ursoc's Corpse when you've accomplished this.^The time has come
column4: <name>. Now we will learn whether our efforts will accomplish what we need or nothing at all. Take these ashes and seek the furbolg that Kodian told you about
column5: Tur Ragepaw
column6: near Ursoc's Den. You will find the den to the north of Grizzlemaw. Convince Tur to aid you
column7: for you will need all the help you can get. Once you've defeated the bear god

column9: his spirit must be saved.

column1: Flight of the Wintergarde Defender^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Gryphon Commander Urik^Gryphon Commander Urik^The Lost Courier^^^Rescue 10 Helpless Wintergarde Villagers and return to Gryphon Commander Urik at Wintergarde Keep.^With this whistle you can call down a Wintergarde gryphon. Mount the creature and head towards the ruins of Wintergarde Village
column2: now known as the Carrion Fields
column3: southeast of here. Once at the fields
column4: keep your eyes peeled for helpless Wintergarde villagers. When you spot one
column5: fly low and use the gryphon to pick them up. Return the rescued villager here
column6: to the gryphon station. There are Scourge all over the place so you'll need to keep your wits about you
column7: hero. Good luck!

column1: Cleansing Drak'Tharon^75^All^Drak'Tharon Keep^Image of Drakuru^Drakuru^Good Troll Hunting^^Darkness Calling
column2: Reunited^Drakuru wants you to use Drakuru's Elixir at his brazier inside Drak'Tharon. Using Drakuru's Elixir there will require 5 Enduring Mojo.^The time be here at last
column3: good friend. Drak'Tharon soon be cleansed of them foul undead and restored to her noble purpose. My soul will be havin' peace
column4: and in return for your help
column5: the keep's most valuable treasures be yours
column6: mon! Da keep rises up into a sacred ziggurat. Once ya be reachin' its top
column7: ya must summon me a final time
column8: and I'll perform the ritual. Alas
column9: mon
column10: my summonin' will again be comin' at a cost. Ya must collect the mojo from the survivors in the keep

column1: The Spy in New Hearthglen^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Spy Mistress Repine^Agent Skully^Need to Know^^^Deliver the Scarlet Onslaught Daily Orders to Agent Skully at New Hearthglen.^I have a spy within the ranks of the Scarlet Onslaught. I need you to deliver these daily orders to her so that she can plan the next phase of our assault. She goes by the name of Agent Skully and she's under a magical guise to appear as the Onslaught's cemetery caretaker. Here
column2: take these orders to her
column3: and then do as she asks. You'll find the graveyard on the side of the abbey.

column1: A Means to an End^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Apothecary Vicky Levine^Apothecary Vicky Levine^A Means to an End^^^Apothecary Vicky Levine at Venomspite has asked you to use the Levine Family Termites to lure Foreman Kaleiki out and kill him.^I received a few barrels of termites from my sister at the Bulwark back home in the last shipment. I think they're going to come in handy for something I have in mind for you. The lumbermill operations at New Hearthglen are problematic for us
column2: but so far we haven't been able to get anyone in there to take out their foreman. I think that if you were to unleash these termites on his precious woodworks
column3: he'd be sure to come running. Ready to take him out
column4: <class>?

column1: Destroy the Sapling^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Windseer Grayhorn^Windseer Grayhorn^Destroy the Sapling^^Ursoc
column2: the Bear God^Windseer Grayhorn in Conquest Hold wants you to take the Verdant Torch and use it to burn Vordrassil's Sapling. Bring Vordrassil's Ashes back to Windseer Grayhorn.^The furbolgs' work must be undone
column3: <name>. The best of intentions do not count for much when the result is tainted by such strong a corruption. The sapling must be destroyed
column4: for it is the source of this dark influence. Take this torch and use it to set fire to the corrupted sapling and bring me its ashes. Once cleansed
column5: by fire
column6: I will use what power I can to remove the taint from them. You will need the ashes to purify Ursoc from the evil power that holds sway over him.

column1: Vordrassil's Seeds^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Windseer Grayhorn^Windseer Grayhorn^Vordrassil's Seeds^^Ursoc
column2: the Bear God^Windseer Grayhorn in Conquest Hold wants you to go to Grizzlemaw and obtain 8 of Vordrassil's Seeds.^We must make sure that Vordrassil is never regrown. The furbolg must have harvested its seed. Go to Grizzlemaw
column3: in central Grizzly Hills
column4: and obtain all the seeds that you can find. I will make sure they're properly destroyed.

column1: Fire Upon the Waters^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Apothecary Vicky Levine^Apothecary Vicky Levine^A Means to an End^^^Apothecary Vicky Levine at Venomspite has asked you to use her Apothecary's Burning Water to set the sails of the Sinner's Folly afire.^I have another mission for you. I was able to repurpose some of the blight to concoct my world-famous burning water. I want you to take it and set the sails of the Sinner's Folly ablaze! Use it from the dock. Once the sails are on fire
column2: the deckhands will be busy putting them out
column3: and you'll slip belowdecks to 'retrieve' the captain's rutters. You'll find the ship on Crusader's Landing
column4: below and south of New Hearthglen. Look for the captain's quarters on the first lower deck
column5: behind the stairs.

column1: Shredder Repair^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Synipus^Synipus^^^^Synipus at Blue Sky Logging Grounds wants you to bring 3 Broken-down Shredders back to him.^Listen
column2: pal. Why don't ya roll up your sleeves and grab a wrench? There's work to be done! They need these shredders refurbished and sent down to Venture Bay
column3: and they need it done yesterday.... No wrench? Well what good are ya then? May as well go down with the rest of the lugheads and play with the Horde! While you're there
column4: see if you can drive some of those broken-down shredders up here for repairs. Be careful! They're in pretty bad shape.

column1: No Mercy for the Captured^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Spy Mistress Repine^High Executor Wroth^No Mercy for the Captured^^^Spy Mistress Repine has asked you to slay Deathguard Schneider
column2: Senior Scrivener Barriga
column3: Engineer Burke
column4: and Chancellor Amai.^We have more fools for you to kill. My agents tell me that several of our good citizens have seen fit to fall into the hands of the Scarlet Onslaught. This will not do. Go back to New Hearthglen and eliminate Deathguard Schneider
column5: Senior Scrivener Barriga
column6: Engineer Burke and Chancellor Amai. From what I hear
column7: they're spread out throughout the area. No doubt they are being kept in cages awaiting torture. Speak with them and then kill them!

column1: A Possible Link^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Hierophant Thayreen^Hierophant Thayreen^^A Dark Influence^Vordrassil's Sapling^Hierophant Thayreen at Amberpine Lodge wants you to obtain 8 Crazed Furbolg Blood from the Furbolgs at Heart's Blood Shrine and Rage Fang Shrine.^The furbolgs that live east of here are more aggressive and bestial than the ones we're used to. Our forces have squared off with them more than once
column2: and the survivors always speak of a dark
column3: slimy substance dripping from their corpses. Their condition could be linked with the contaminants we found on Vordrassil's remains. Bring me samples of the furbolgs' blood. You will find them in the Rage Fang Shrine and the Heart's Blood Shrine
column4: far to the east.

column1: Children of Ursoc^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Hierophant Thayreen^Hierophant Thayreen^^The Failed World Tree^Vordrassil's Seeds^Hierophant Thayreen at Amberpine Lodge wants you to speak to Orsonn at the Rage Fang Shrine and Kodian at the Heart's Blood Shrine.^The furbolgs of Grizzly Hills carry with them a corruption of some kind
column2: that is for sure. Tribal war has broken out amongst them after years of peaceful coexistence. What remains to be seen is whether the bears they worship as gods have also been tainted. Ursoc's two children
column3: Orsonn and Kodian
column4: dwell in the Heart's Blood Shrine and the Rage Fang Shrine
column5: south and southeast of Grizzlemaw. See if they will speak to you regarding what has happened here.

column1: Vordrassil's Sapling^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Hierophant Thayreen^Hierophant Thayreen^Vordrassil's Sapling^A Possible Link^Ursoc
column2: the Bear God^Hierophant Thayreen in Amberpine Lodge wants you to take the Verdant Torch and use it to burn Vordrassil's Sapling. Bring Vordrassil's Ashes back to Hierophant Thayreen.^The druids of old seem to have had good reasons for destroying Vordrassil. We cannot let the furbolgs regrow it. On the other hand
column3: saving Ursoc's spirit hinges on the magic contained by the sapling. Take this torch and use it to burn the tree. You will find it in the middle of Grizzlemaw
column4: inside Vordrassil's old trunk. Bring me Vordrassil's ashes. It is my hope that once purified by fire
column5: we may use its magic to cleanse Ursoc's spirit of its dark taint.

column1: Ursoc
column2: the Bear God^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Hierophant Thayreen^Hierophant Thayreen^Vordrassil's Sapling^Vordrassil's Sapling
column3: Vordrassil's Seeds^^Hierophant Thayreen at Amberpine Lodge wants you to find Tur Ragepaw near Ursoc's Den and defeat Ursoc with his help. Use the Purified Ashes of Vordrassil on Ursoc's Corpse when you've accomplished this.^It is time
column4: <name>. Take these ashes and look for the furbolg that Kodian spoke of. If he went to seek Ursoc
column5: he will be near his den
column6: north of Grizzlemaw. You will need his help. You won't be able to defeat Ursoc alone. Once you've defeated Ursoc
column7: use these ashes to purify his spirit. Only then will we know whether our efforts have been in vain or not.

column1: Vordrassil's Seeds^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Hierophant Thayreen^Hierophant Thayreen^Vordrassil's Seeds^Children of Ursoc^Ursoc
column2: the Bear God^Hierophant Thayreen at Amberpine Lodge wants you to go to Grizzlemaw and obtain 8 of Vordrassil's Seeds.^We cannot allow Vordrassil to grow again. If the furbolg regrew it once
column3: they can do it again. Go to Grizzlemaw
column4: in central Grizzly Hills
column5: and obtain Vordrassil's seeds. I will make sure they're properly disposed of.

column1: Return to the High Commander^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Gryphon Commander Urik^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^The Lost Courier^^Not In Our Mine
column2: The Bleeding Ore
column3: The Demo-gnome
column4: Imprints on the Past
column5: Wanted: Kreug Oathbreaker
column6: Wanted: High Shaman Bloodpaw
column7: Wanted: Onslaught Commander Iustus
column8: My Old Enemy^Speak with High Commander Halford Wyrmbane at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight.^Return to High Commander Halford Wyrmbane at once
column9: <name>. Let him know that your mission was a success and that the few remaining villagers that were rescued are back to work.

column1: Torture the Torturer^72^Horde^Dragonblight^High Executor Wroth^High Executor Wroth^No Mercy for the Captured^^^High Executor Wroth at Venomspite wants you to use the branding iron 5 times on Torturer LeCraft to get the information out of him. After that
column2: kill him.^Enough! I want you to put an end to the torture of my people! The Onslaught's torturer
column3: LeCraft
column4: has been bleeding information out of everyone that gets caught by those fiends! I need to know what they know. My sources tell me that he has set up shop in the basement of their barracks
column5: which is right next to the smithy. I'll loan you my personal branding iron to see to it that the job is done right. Find him and get that information.

column1: Rescue from Town Square^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^The Lost Courier^^^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight wants you to rescue 6 Trapped Wintergarde Villagers.^Just down this path here is Wintergarde's town square. Once a hive of activity for the citizens of Wintergarde
column2: now a warzone
column3: filled with murderous geists hell-bent on vengeance towards the living. In the buildings surrounding the town square are trapped villagers that must be rescued! I ask much of you
column4: now
column5: <name>
column6: but you are the only soldier I can spare. Free our people. Take this path down into town square and enter those houses. Kill anything that gets in your way! Return to me should you survive.

column1: Without a Prayer^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Agent Skully^Agent Skully^Need to Know^^^Agent Skully at New Hearthglen has asked you to acquire Bishop Street's Prayer Book.^These plans indicate something imminent is being planned. But first
column2: there's the matter of this strange protection that the Onslaught forces have. If Venomspite is to deal with them once and for all
column3: we must find out who's behind it and eliminate them. I've noticed that the bishop in the chapel on the far side of New Hearthglen
column4: across from the lumbermill
column5: has stepped up his blessing of the troops. Kill him and steal his prayer book. Maybe it will give us a clue.

column1: The Thane of Voldrune^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Woodsman Drake^Woodsman Drake^Secrets of the Flamebinders^^^Use Flamebringer to defeat Thane Torvald Eriksson and report to Woodsman Drake at Amberpine Lodge.^Now that you've captured the flame-imbued talismans and weakened Voldrune's defenses
column2: we can strike at its leader
column3: Thane Torvald Eriksson. The thane's favorite mount is an unruly proto-drake he calls Flamebringer. It is kept bound in chains in the western part of Voldrune
column4: but with the talismans
column5: you should be able to control it long enough to use it against the thane. Once you have Flamebringer under your control
column6: search the tops of the towers of Voldrune for the thane and show him no mercy.

column1: The Flamebinders' Secrets^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Sergeant Nazgrim^Sergeant Nazgrim^The Flamebinders' Secrets^^The Thane of Voldrune^Bring 3 Flame-Imbued Talismans to Sergeant Nazgrim at Conquest Hold.^Even as the Alliance cowards attack our positions
column2: the Dragonflayer vrykul outpost of Voldrune
column3: to the southeast
column4: prepares for war. The vrykul are far from the strongest enemy we face here
column5: but we must eliminate them before they can truly threaten us. Their most powerful warriors are permitted to ride half-trained proto-drakes into battle. To control the beasts
column6: their flamebinders create powerful talismans. You'll need to slay them and take the talismans if our plan is to work.

column1: A Show of Strength^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Sergeant Nazgrim^Sergeant Nazgrim^The High Executor Needs You^^The Thane of Voldrune^Kill 12 Dragonflayer Huscarls and return to Sergeant Nazgrim at Conquest Hold.^Preparations for war are underway in the vrykul village of Voldrune to the southeast. Voldrune's thane cannot field a large army
column2: but with our forces spread thin
column3: we are still at risk. We cannot risk giving the thane and his men an opportunity to attack
column4: so we must take the battle to them. If you are truly a <class> of the Horde
column5: you will relish the chance to demonstrate our strength. Cut down the huscarls and prove to this Dragonflayer clan that the Horde is not to be trifled with!

column1: The Fate of the Dead^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Commander Lynore Windstryke^Commander Lynore Windstryke^^^^Commander Lynore Windstryke at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight wants you to kill 15 Vengeful Geists.^The town square
column2: down this path
column3: is overrun with the undead citizens of Wintergarde! Our own crypt provides a seemingly endless supply of soldiers for the Scourge to throw at us. Take no pity on them
column4: though
column5: <name>. While they were once mortal
column6: capable of compassion and thought
column7: they are now ravaging undead with only one purpose: our destruction. Venture forth to the town square and deliver the vengeful geists to their maker. Give them peace.

column1: The Thane of Voldrune^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Sergeant Nazgrim^Sergeant Nazgrim^The Flamebinders' Secrets^The Flamebinders' Secrets
column2: A Show of Strength^^Use Flamebringer to defeat Thane Torvald Eriksson and report to Sergeant Nazgrim at Conquest Hold.^With the flame-imbued talismans
column3: we can finally challenge the thane. His favorite mount is a ferocious proto-drake called Flamebringer. It is kept bound in chains in the western part of Voldrune
column4: but with the power of the talismans
column5: you should be able to bend it to your will and use it against the thane. Once you have Flamebringer under your control
column6: search the tops of the towers of Voldrune for the thane and use Flamebringer to destroy him.

column1: The Perfect Dissemblance^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Agent Skully^Agent Skully^Need to Know^^^Agent Skully at New Hearthglen has asked you steal the image of a Onslaught Raven Priest. Return the Banshee's Magic Mirror to her when you have done so.^You may wonder how I can maintain this guise; I use a magic mirror that was loaned to me by the spy mistress. It only has so much power in it
column2: but I think there's enough for the both of us. Here
column3: take it. I want you to use it to impersonate one of the Onslaught raven priests. Be quick about it... I have no idea how long my glamour will last while you have the mirror. Realize that you won't immediately be perfectly disguised
column4: so don't count on it being foolproof until I've had a chance to help you.

column1: No Place to Run^74^All^Dragonblight^Serinar^Serinar^No Place to Run^The Obsidian Dragonshrine^^Place a Destructive Ward at the end of the path leading out of Obsidian Dragonshrine
column2: where the road starts to give way to snow. Protect the ward until it is fully charged
column3: then return to Serinar.^They're drawing power from the bones of my dead brothers... I have no love for the cult
column4: but I'm baffled by their audacity. There will be no mercy shown for them... not that I ever would have anyway. Ensure that they have no place to flee when the slaughter starts. Place a destructive ward at the end of the path leading out of the shrine... where the road starts to give way to snow. Defend it until it is fully charged.

column1: No One to Save You^74^All^Dragonblight^Serinar^Serinar^^The Obsidian Dragonshrine^^Kill 6 Burning Depths Necrolytes and 10 Smoldering Skeletons outside of the Obsidian Dragonshrine. Return to Serinar once the task is complete.^We will spare no one. Outside
column2: lowly necrolytes and their skeletal servants shame my land with their presence. Slaughter them all.

column1: The Best of Intentions^74^All^Dragonblight^Serinar^Serinar^No Place to Run^^Culling the Damned
column2: Defiling the Defilers^Wait for Serinar to administer the disguise of a Burning Depths Necrolyte
column3: then proceed to the back of the Maw of Neltharion to uncover what the Cult of the Damned is doing there. Return to Serinar with details regarding their purpose.^The Cult of the Damned has not come just to extract power from dead dragons. I suspect I know what they are up to
column4: but I need you to prove me correct. I will grant you the guise of this dead necrolyte. Proceed to the back of the cave and confirm their intentions for being in this sacred place. I will watch through your eyes. Be cautious <name>
column5: any damage done to you is likely to break the fragile illusion.

column1: Culling the Damned^74^All^Dragonblight^Serinar^Serinar^^The Best of Intentions^^Kill 3 Burning Depths Necromancers
column2: 6 Smoldering Constructs
column3: and 6 Smoldering Geist in the Maw of Neltharion
column4: and then return to Serinar.^The cave beyond was swarming with Cult atrocities. There is only one way to deal with such creatures... you know what to do.

column1: Defiling the Defilers^74^All^Dragonblight^Serinar^Serinar^Defiling the Defilers^The Best of Intentions^^Locate and stamp out 8 Necromantic Runes that have been drawn on the floor inside the Maw of Neltharion. Return to Serinar once the task is complete.^I sensed a large accumulation of magic in the runes that we witnessed when you were scouting the cave. I will not have you toy with extracting the magic... often the most straight forward solution is the most effective one. Destroy the runes... stamp them out and ensure that the Cult will not have access to whatever power that they've accumulated there.
Tales of Destruction^74^All^Dragonblight^Serinar^Nalice^Defiling the Defilers^^^Travel back to Wyrmrest and let Nalice know that Serinar's task is complete.^You can leave now
column2: <race>. Go tell Nalice she missed out on a good slaughter.

column1: Neltharion's Flame^75^All^Dragonblight^Serinar^Serinar^Defiling the Defilers^^^Use Neltharion's Flame to douse the summoning area in the back of the Maw of Neltharion. Once you get the attention of Rothin the Decaying
column2: kill him
column3: then return to Serinar at the front of the cave.^With the cult's ranks thinned and some of their power stripped
column4: it's time to strike at the source of the corruption. Rothin the Decaying is resurrecting black dragons as magmawyrms in the back of the cave. Go to the summoning chamber and cleanse the remaining bones in the only way that will ensure that they will never be toyed with again... with flame. Burning the bones will surely gain Rothin's attention
column5: see to it that he is destroyed as well. The magic in this vial should see the task done.

column1: Pieces Parts^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Pipthwack^Pipthwack^^^^Pipthwack in Blue Sky Logging Grounds wants you to collect 4 Grooved Cogs
column2: 3 Notched Sprockets
column3: and 2 High Tension Springs.^Ack! This thing's a mess! Goblin engineering leaves a great deal to be desired
column4: believe you me. Just look at this! It's a wonder it ever worked to begin with. Give me a hand
column5: will ya? To get this even close to operable specifications I'll need to replace a few cogs
column6: sprockets
column7: and springs. You should have no trouble finding them down around the sawmill.

column1: Not In Our Mine^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Highlord Leoric Von Zeldig^Highlord Leoric Von Zeldig^^Return to the High Commander^^Highlord Leoric Von Zeldig at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight wants you to recover 10 Wintergarde Miner's Cards.^That blasted necropolis blindsided us! In the wake of its destruction Wintergarde Mine was lost. Worse yet
column2: Kel'Thuzad's acolytes have raised the slain miners as Scourge and are using them to supply their siegesmiths with materials from our mine! The supply line must be halted and our lost brothers must be put to rest. Travel to Wintergarde Mine
column3: northeast of here in the Carrion Fields
column4: and destroy the risen miners. Return to me with their miner cards so that I may put their passing in our registry.

column1: Shred the Alliance^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Grekk^Grekk^^^^Grekk at Blue Sky Logging Grounds wants you to acquire 3 shredders and return to him with them.^Read my lips
column2: <class> - I need those shredders! Just as important - I need to keep them out of the hands of the Alliance! They've been refurbishing the shredders and using them against our brothers in Venture Bay. Now we're going to give them a taste of their own medicine! You see a shredder out there
column3: grab it! You see one of the Alliance scum on one
column4: kill 'em and then grab it! Once you have one
column5: drive it back here to me and we'll get to work on it. Dismissed!

column1: The Rod of Compulsion^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Torturer's Rod^High Executor Wroth^The Rod of Compulsion^^^Deliver the Torturer's Rod to High Executor Wroth at Venomspite.^A rod drops from LeCraft's dead hand. There are pulsing magical runes along its length. Could this be how he was getting his confessions? Better let the high executor have a look at it.

The Bleeding Ore^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Siege Engineer Quarterflash^Siege Engineer Quarterflash^^Return to the High Commander^Understanding the Scourge War Machine^Siege Engineer Quarterflash at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight wants you to recover 10 samples of Strange Ore from Wintergarde Mine.^Hours before the Naxxramas invasion
column2: one of the miners stumbled upon a dark ore that was oozing a viscous fluid. In the chaos that occurred during the evacuation of the mine
column3: we lost the samples taken from the alien node. Now the Scourge prospects the ore for use in their machines of death. You must get back to Wintergarde Mine
column4: due northeast of here in the Carrion Fields
column5: and recover the strange ore. It is imperative to our mission's success!

column1: The Denouncement^73^Horde^Dragonblight^High Executor Wroth^High Executor Wroth^The Rod of Compulsion^^^High Executor Wroth at Venomspite has tasked you with using the Rod of Compulsion on Commander Jordan
column2: Lead Cannoneer Zierhut
column3: Blacksmith Goodman
column4: and Stable Master Mercer.^It's time for us to utterly demoralize the Onslaught forces! I want you to take the rod and use it on four of their leaders: Commander Jordan upstairs at the barracks
column5: Lead Cannoneer Zierhut down the southeast ramp overlooking the beach
column6: Blacksmith Goodman at the smithy
column7: and Stable Master Mercer at the stables. Place them under the rod's compulsion
column8: concentrate on making them denounce the Onslaught
column9: and then kill them!

column1: A Fall From Grace^73^Horde^Dragonblight^Agent Skully^Agent Skully^Need to Know^^^Agent Skully at New Hearthglen has asked you to ring the bell in the abbey and then go speak with the high abbot and get information out of him.^We need more information from the high abbot
column2: and now that we have the visage of one of the raven priests
column3: I think we can get you close to talk with him. Unfortunately
column4: we need to separate him from his bodyguards or you'll never get any information out of him. <The agent leans on her shovel and thinks a moment.> I think I've got it! While in disguise
column5: go to the top of the abbey and ring the bell. That should bring the abbot's bodyguards running and you can then head down to speak with him.

column1: The Demo-gnome^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^Siege Engineer Quarterflash^The Demo-gnome^Return to the High Commander^^Speak with Siege Engineer Quarterflash at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight.^Quarterflash recently requisitioned my group for a specialist that he could send on a reconnaissance mission to the Wintergarde Mine. To that end
column2: I sent him Slinkin
column3: my demolitionist. I foolishly thought that he could close off that pit of damnation after his mission for Quarterflash was complete
column4: securing another victory for us against the Scourge. An entire day has now passed and Slinkin has not returned. I want answers! Speak with Siege Engineer Quarterflash and track down my missing agent!

column1: The Search for Slinkin^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Siege Engineer Quarterflash^Slinkin the Demo-gnome^The Demo-gnome^^^Find Slinkin the Demo-gnome in Wintergarde Mine. Use Quarterflash's Homing Bot if you need help finding the mine.^While I have not heard from Slinkin or know what fate has befallen him
column2: perhaps I can assist in finding him. <Quarterflash holds up a tiny mechanical toy.> This is not a toy
column3: newfound compatriot. It is
column4: in fact
column5: my latest mechanical creation. The machine was created with the sole purpose of finding that which has been lost. These are unfortunate circumstances
column6: but the machine is your best chance at finding Slinkin. When you are ready to begin your search
column7: place the bot on the ground next to me.

column1: Leave Nothing to Chance^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Slinkin the Demo-gnome^Siege Engineer Quarterflash^The Demo-gnome^^Understanding the Scourge War Machine^Retrieve a Wintergarde Mine Bomb and use it to blow up the Upper Wintergarde Mine Shaft and the Lower Wintergarde Mine Shaft. Report back to Siege Engineer Quarterflash at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight when you have completed this task.^If there is good in your heart and your conscience is clear
column2: read on. In this mine
column3: near the foreman's scaffold
column4: rests a hefty cargo of dynamite. Go there and pick up several bundles of the explosive and make your way towards the entrance of the mine. Once there
column5: set the dynamite and blow up the entrance. Remember to do this for the upper and lower entry points of Wintergarde Mine. You must leave nothing to chance. The evil that exists here must never be allowed out. Light guide you.

column1: A Bear of an Appetite^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Hugh Glass^Hugh Glass^^^^Bring 6 Northern Salmon to Hugh Glass at the Redwood Trading Post.^Thank goodness you're back
column2: Limpy! I worried that Griselda and I were going to be all alone. I'm cooking up some food here for us
column3: but Griselda'll have none of it. She's fond of the fish that live off the coast of the Eastwind Shore
column4: to the east. Can't stand them myself
column5: but she's always been a picky eater. Six good-sized fish ought to keep her happy for a while. Now
column6: run... err... limp along
column7: Joe. Wouldn't want to keep the girl waiting
column8: would ya?

column1: Making Repairs^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Lurz^Lurz^^^^Lurz at Blue Sky Logging Grounds wants you to collect 4 Grooved Cogs
column2: 3 Notched Sprockets
column3: and 2 High Tension Springs.^Twenty shredders by noon tomorrow! Who makes these schedules
column4: anyway? No one who ever put one of these garbage cans back together
column5: that's who.... If I'm going to hit my quota
column6: I'll need a hand. Help me out and I'll share my commission with you - fair enough? I need cogs
column7: sprockets and springs. They're littered across the ground down by the shredders.

column1: Understanding the Scourge War Machine^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Siege Engineer Quarterflash^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^^The Bleeding Ore
column2: Leave Nothing to Chance^Into Hostile Territory^Deliver Quarterflash's Package to High Commander Halford Wyrmbane at Wintergarde Keep.^We must take solace in the fact that Slinkin's death
column3: while tragic
column4: was for the greater good. His discovery coupled with your heroics in the mine and the samples you returned brings us one step closer to understanding the Scourge war machine. Take this package to High Commander Halford Wyrmbane. It holds a sample of the strange ore and my analysis.

column1: Imprints on the Past^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Zelig the Visionary^Zelig the Visionary^Imprints on the Past^Return to the High Commander^^Zelig the Visionary at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight wants you to recover his Scrying Orb.^The memories of the past haunt this land
column2: <name>. I hear the cries of the fallen echo across Northrend - calling to me. Arthas left a terrible imprint on everything he touched. Only wither and decay remains in his wake. It is important
column3: then
column4: for us to study the past so that we may better know our enemy. Perhaps untold truths shall surface that could help in our campaign. First
column5: you must recover my scrying orb from the town hall
column6: <name>. Exit this tower and turn left down the path to reach the town square.

column1: The Truth Will Out^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Agent Skully^High Executor Wroth^Need to Know^^^Agent Skully has asked you to acquire The Diary of High General Abbendis and to deliver it to High Executor Wroth at Venomspite.^We have to figure out what's going on here. We need the general's diary! I'm pretty sure that you'll find it on her nightstand upstairs at her house. It's the one next to church
column2: across from the stables and the lumbermill. Once you acquire the diary
column3: take it to the high executor back at Venomspite. You'll have to do this the old-fashioned way; the power of the mirror is low and there's only enough left for me. <The agent smirks.>

column1: Keep 'Em on Their Heels^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Commander Bargok^Commander Bargok^^^^Commander Bargok wants you to kill 15 Alliance units or players in Blue Sky Logging Ground.^We've suffered heavy casualties here
column2: <race>. The only good news is that we've given as much as we've taken. I've requested more troops
column3: but the bulk of our forces are bogged down in Venture Bay. It looks like we're on our own for now. No matter how bad it gets
column4: we MUST stand our ground! The precious resources of this region are essential to the Horde's long-term success in Northrend. We've got to keep the Alliance on their heels until help arrives. Get out there and give 'em something to think about.

column1: Do Unto Others^73^Horde^Dragonblight^High Executor Wroth^High Executor Wroth^Need to Know^^^High Executor Wroth at Venomspite has ordered you to return with The Head of the High General.^Their attack is imminent
column2: <class>. I need you to get in there and sever the head of the Scarlet Onslaught
column3: literally! It's not going to be easy... Abbendis is sure to be surrounded by a great many of her men. I suggest that you take at least a couple of friends along. Bring back her head and I'll see to it that you're properly rewarded for saving Venomspite. Fail and don't even bother to return!

column1: Orik Trueheart and the Forgotten Shore^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Zelig the Visionary^Orik Trueheart^Imprints on the Past^^^Seek out the assistance of Orik Trueheart at Dawn's Reach in Dragonblight.^I have gazed upon the orb and seen the path that you must walk
column2: <name>. Many years ago an atrocity was committed upon the shores of Dragonblight. The act itself remains shrouded in darkness
column3: but I am certain that your destiny lies south
column4: amidst the ruins of the Forgotten Shore. Take the road southeast through the ravaged town square. Follow the trail until you arrive at Dawn's Reach. You will meet an old friend of mine there known as Orik Trueheart. He will be expecting you.

column1: Overwhelmed!^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Aumana^Aumana^^^^Aumana at Blue Sky Logging Grounds wants you to use the Renewing Tourniquet on 10 Wounded Skirmishers.^You there
column2: <class>! Help me! We're losing valuable lives! There are simply too many wounded for me to tend to alone. If we can't get our soldiers healed we could be run out of Grizzly Hills altogether! Take this tourniquet and use it on the wounded down on the battlefield. Hurry
column3: <name>! They're dyyying!!

column1: Kick 'Em While They're Down^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Sergeant Hartsman^Sergeant Hartsman^^^^Sergeant Hartsman wants you to defeat 15 Horde units or players in Blue Sky Logging Grounds.^It is a dark day for the Alliance. Many good men lay dead or dying here. Our only consolation is that they fought well and brought down many of the enemy with them. With the bulk of our forces committed to Venture Bay we stand alone to weather this storm. The resources in this region are vital to the Alliance and may well make the difference in our struggle against the Horde. We must not fail! Go
column2: <name>. Strike at them while they lick their wounds. Avenge your fallen brothers and keep our hopes alive!

column1: The Murkweed Elixir^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Orik Trueheart^Orik Trueheart^Imprints on the Past^^^Orik Trueheart at Dawn's Reach in Dragonblight wants you to recover 5 Murkweed from the Eldritch Heights.^The spirits of the damned haunt the coast. In life they were brave and noble soldiers of the Alliance
column2: but in death they are cursed - bound to this world until the end of days. We must discover the source of their anguish if we are to free them! To the southeast
column3: on the Eldritch Heights
