column4: you will find a rare herb known as murkweed. It is murkweed that I will use to concoct an elixir that will allow you temporary entry into the world of the forgotten. Go now and gather the weed.

column1: The Forgotten Tale^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Orik Trueheart^Orik Trueheart^Imprints on the Past^^^Orik Trueheart at Dawn's Reach in Dragonblight wants you to hear the tales of a Forgotten Peasant
column2: Forgotten Rifleman
column3: Forgotten Knight and Forgotten Footman.^The toxins in the murkweed elixir will render you unconscious. So powerful is the effect of the murkweed that even your spirit will be fooled
column4: allowing you to temporarily enter the world of the dead. Once a spirit
column5: you must speak to the ghostly denizens of the Forgotten Shore. Seek out the cause of their anguish and return to me. Remember
column6: <name>
column7: these spirits were once Alliance soldiers. Treat them with respect
column8: honor and dignity. Now
column9: with elixir in hand
column10: venture south to the Forgotten Shore.

column1: Local Support^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Lieutenant Dumont^Lieutenant Dumont^Local Support^^^Lieutenant Dumont at Amberpine Lodge wants you to go to Evergreen Trading Post and obtain the Cedar Chest.^We've reached a deadlock with the Horde in Grizzly Hills. Our forces are just about evenly matched and all signs so far have pointed to a stalemate. Until this morning
column2: that is. The local trappers have requested our help. Apparently the Horde took something that belongs to them... a relic of some sort. We get this back for them and they'll give us the edge we need. Head to the Evergreen Trading Post
column3: west of Conquest Hold and look for a cedar chest.

column1: Close the Deal^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Lieutenant Dumont^Ivan^Local Support^^^Bring the Cedar Chest to Ivan at Aspen Grove Post.^We have what the trappers want. Now it's up to us to sign them up with our side. Take the chest to a trapper named Ivan at the Aspen Grove Post
column2: just north of here. If all goes well
column3: we'll have local woodsmen serving as scouts for the king's army in no time.

column1: A Tentative Pact^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Ivan^Lieutenant Dumont^Local Support^^Secrets of the Flamebinders
column2: Thinning the Ranks^Return to Lieutenant Dumont in Amberpine Lodge.^Very well
column3: <name>. Your people kept their end of the bargain. Tell Dumont that we'll honor the deal.

column1: An Exercise in Diplomacy^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Lieutenant Dumont^Envoy Ducal^Local Support^^Northern Hospitality
column2: Wolfsbane Root^Speak to Envoy Ducal in Silverbrook.^We'd been trying to negotiate with the trappers for weeks
column3: but we'd gotten nowhere until you found that blasted chest of theirs. This should be good news to our envoy in Silverbrook. We sent Ducal there about a week ago and his last letter indicated he'd been making little progress. Go to Silverbrook and aid him in his diplomatic efforts. Take the roads heading northwest of here and you should find it after crossing a couple of bridges.

column1: Life or Death^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Rheanna^Rheanna^^^^Rheanna at Blue Sky Logging Grounds wants you to use the Renewing Bandage on 10 Wounded Westfall Infantry units.^Oh
column2: the carnage.... I've been through many battles
column3: <class>
column4: and this one was more brutal than any I've seen. Our fight with the Horde has become more intense than ever. It's them or us here in Northrend - life or death. If we are to survive here another day we'll need to mend our wounded. There are too many for me to rescue alone. I've prepared special bandages that will enable you to assist me. Take one and tend to those who have not yet succumbed to their wounds.

column1: Of Traitors and Treason^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Captain Adams^Greer Orehammer^Of Traitors and Treason^^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^Captain Adams has asked you to show the Alliance Missive to Greer Orehammer at Westguard Keep.^The list I hold must be delivered to High Commander Halford Wyrmbane. He commands the 7th Legion
column2: stationed at Wintergarde Keep on the eastern borders of the Great Dragonblight. If any of the traitors on this list are stationed at Wintergarde... it could be catastrophic. Hurry
column3: <name>. Show the document to Greer Orehammer here at Westguard Keep and explain the nature of your mission. He'll put you on his fastest gryphon to Wintergarde!

column1: High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Greer Orehammer^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^Of Traitors and Treason^^^Deliver the Alliance Missive to High Commander Halford Wyrmbane at Wintergarde Keep in eastern Dragonblight.^<Greer hands the missive back to you.> Skysong will take you to Wintergarde
column2: <name>. I guarantee you that it will be the fastest flight you've ever taken. Go now!

column1: Northern Hospitality^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Sergei^Sergei^^An Exercise in Diplomacy^Test of Mettle^Sergei at Silverbrook wants you to slay 8 Conquest Hold Marauders.^It's good to meet you. Let us celebrate our pact by partaking in some good old fashioned Horde-killing. You'll find marauders from Conquest Hold just outside our town
column2: west of here. Why don't you head out there and hunt them like the filthy animals they are? Let's see if our new allies can back all their talk with some action.

column1: Test of Mettle^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Sergei^Captured Trapper^Test of Mettle^Northern Hospitality
column2: Wolfsbane Root^^Find Sergeant Bonesnap northwest of Silverbrook and pass the Test of Mettle.^Alright
column3: friend. You've done us a favor or two
column4: but that's not the true test of a person's courage. Around these parts
column5: you're not a real hunter unless you wear your prey's skin. <Sergei unsheathes his skinning knife and hands it to you.> The leader of those motherless orcs attacking our town is called Bonesnap; you'll find him at a camp further northwest. That's right. You're going to skin the monster.

column1: The Truth Shall Set Us Free^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Orik Trueheart^Orik Trueheart^Imprints on the Past^^^Orik Trueheart at Dawn's Reach in Dragonblight wants you to use Orik's Crystalline Orb in the ruins located at the Forgotten Shore to redeem the Forgotten.^Zelig gave this crystal ball to me years ago with specific instruction on its use. For five years - whenever I would feel anger
column2: anxiety
column3: or sorrow over the events that transpired here - I was to focus my thoughts upon the orb. I now understand why Zelig gave this crystal to me. Take my crystalline orb to the Forgotten Shore. Find the ruins of my old base on the upper reaches of the beach and place the orb in the center of town. Let the forgotten see the world through my heart and soul.

column1: Words of Warning^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Captured Trapper^Caged Prisoner^Test of Mettle^^Escape from Silverbrook^Go to the northwestern end of Silverbrook.^Thanks for helping me
column2: <name>. My name's Sasha. Listen
column3: I have to get the hell out of here. The people that sent you here... my people... they've changed. They're not good people anymore... and they want to turn you into one of... one of them. This... 'test' they sent you on is just the beginning. Head to the northwestern end of Silverbrook. You'll find something of interest to you. Good luck... and trust no one.

column1: Funding the War Effort^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Quartermaster Bartlett^Quartermaster Bartlett^^^^Quartermaster Bartlett at Venomspite has asked you to recover 6 Forgotten Treasure.^<The quartermaster lowers his voice and whispers to you.> <class>
column2: I need your help; our coffers are empty. The Kor'kron Vanguard at the Wrath Gate has taken all of our coin for the fight there. But
column3: I've heard whispers that there's treasure to be had amongst the wrecks on the Forgotten Shore to the southeast. We have to do something soon
column4: or we won't be able to continue the fight against the Scarlet Onslaught. War isn't cheap
column5: you know!

column1: Beachfront Property^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Surveyor Hansen^Surveyor Hansen^^^^Surveyor Hansen
column2: just north of the Forgotten Shore
column3: has asked you to slay 20 Forgotten ghosts.^It's time for Venomspite to expand! We'll take care of the Onslaught in due time
column4: but I want you to spearhead our efforts on the Forgotten Shore. The property value has outstanding potential and just look at that view! Unfortunately
column5: there's an infestation of human ghosts
column6: shipwrecked crews and the like who haven't quite realized that they're dead. Clear the beach and the waters off the shore
column7: and maybe you and I will talk about building a cozy
column8: new mausoleum down there soon.

column1: Parting Thoughts^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Orik Trueheart^Zelig the Visionary^Imprints on the Past^^The Return of the Crusade?
column2: The Path of Redemption^Return to Zelig the Visionary at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight.^You have honored me and honored the memory of hundreds of Alliance veterans
column3: <name>. Zelig was wise in sending you here. Please return to him and give him my thanks. He will be happy to hear of the events that transpired at the Forgotten Shore. I do not have the gift of foresight like Zelig
column4: but I am certain that great things await you
column5: friend. Farewell.

column1: Wolfsbane Root^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Katja^Katja^^An Exercise in Diplomacy^Test of Mettle^Katja in Silverbrook wants you to uproot 8 Wolfsbane Roots.^Have you heard of the wolfsbane plant? It is a horrible weed... it destroys our farmable crops. We spent all of last week cutting them down
column2: but the roots are beginning to sprout again. It might not seem like an urgent matter
column3: but a resurgence of the plant could be a real... disaster. Do you think you could help us by uprooting them where you find them near the village?

column1: Escape from Silverbrook^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Caged Prisoner^Lieutenant Dumont^Escape from Silverbrook^Words of Warning^A Swift Response^Open the Wooden Cage and help the Freed Alliance Scout escape from Silverbrook. Report to Lieutenant Dumont when you reach Amberpine Lodge.^You... you're not one of them? Quick! Let me out! We have to get to Amberpine Lodge immediately! Once Lieutenant Dumont finds out who these people really are
column2: this town will be reduced to rubble!

column1: Find Durkon!^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^Cavalier Durkon^The Lost Courier^^^Seek out Cavalier Durkon at the Wintergarde Crypt in Dragonblight.^After the Scourge breached the south wall
column2: I ordered Cavalier Durkon to investigate the town crypt. Moments ago I was handed his report. The undead that plague us are coming from two sources: the ruins of Wintergarde
column3: now a breeding ground for Scourge
column4: and our very own town crypt! Amidst the chaos and confusion the Scourge managed to get a necrolord inside the crypt. In his message
column5: Durkon requested assistance. You will find him and help him
column6: <name>. The crypt is on the western border of the town square.

column1: A Swift Response^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Lieutenant Dumont^Lieutenant Dumont^Escape from Silverbrook^^The Failed World Tree
column2: A Dark Influence^Lieutenant Dumont wants you to go to Forest's Edge Post and slay Vladek and 7 Silverbrook Hunters.^Our response must be immediate. Decisive. We must teach these savages not to cross us. Our scouts have located what's left of the Silverbrook trappers... you know
column3: the ones you didn't get to douse in flames. Apparently they're blockading the road to the southeast... perhaps they're trying to box us in. Head to the Forest's Edge post and take care of them. Their leader's reported to be a man named Vladek... make sure he's dealt with.

column1: The Noble's Crypt^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Cavalier Durkon^Cavalier Durkon^The Lost Courier^^^Cavalier Durkon at Wintergarde Keep wants you to slay Necrolord Amarion.^Held within the cold stone walls of this crypt are the remains of the nobles and dignitaries that died in Northrend. At its very core now sits a necrolord who raises the corpses as servants of the Scourge. You must make your way to the bottom of the Wintergarde Crypt and kill Necrolord Amarion. Only then will the assault from within cease! And <name>
column2: be on the lookout for any information that might be laying about inside the room where Amarion resides.

column1: Secrets of the Scourge^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Flesh-bound Tome^Cavalier Durkon^Secrets of the Scourge^^^Deliver the Flesh-bound Tome to Cavalier Durkon at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight.^Scrawled across the flesh-bound chapters of this tome are strange symbols and shapes that seem to have been scraped into the pages with a blade. You have no idea what is written
column2: but you are certain that whatever it is
column3: it must be important. Deliver the tome to Cavalier Durkon standing guard topside at Wintergarde Crypt.

column1: Down With Captain Zorna!^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Baron Freeman^Baron Freeman^^^^Slay Captain Zorna and report to Baron Freeman at Venture Bay.^The Horde's forces are poised to break through our lines and complete their conquest of Venture Bay if we do not act. The Horde's forces in the port are commanded by Captain Zorna
column2: near the ship on the far side of the bay. If you can defeat her
column3: the Horde's offensive will falter and we can seize the chance to capture the port. Beware
column4: <name>
column5: for Zorna is a fierce fighter. It may take several people to defeat her
column6: or if you have access to a repaired shredder
column7: you might try using it to your advantage.

column1: Crush Captain Brightwater!^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^General Khazgar^General Khazgar^^^^Slay Captain Brightwater and report to General Khazgar at Venture Bay.^With every advance
column2: our men are met by fresh Alliance reinforcements. It's almost as though their commander anticipates my every move! The time has come for good Captain Brightwater to meet his end. He commands his troops from aboard an Alliance destroyer at the far end of the bay. This will be no easy fight
column3: <name>. Take along a couple of trusted friends
column4: or if you have a key to one of those repaired shredders
column5: use it to disembowel Brightwater! Either way
column6: he must fall!

column1: Keep Them at Bay!^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Lieutenant Stuart^Lieutenant Stuart^^^^Defeat 10 Horde units or players in Venture Bay and return to Lieutenant Stuart.^We cannot permit the Horde to control Venture Bay. The port is essential to our operations in Grizzly Hills and beyond. Captain Stoutmantle has taken the rest of the Westfall Brigade east in search of a passage through the mountains
column2: so we'll have no reinforcements. Go into the field
column3: <name>
column4: and kill the Conquest Hold berserkers the Horde has sent against us. Cut them down until none remain standing. The Alliance must have this port!

column1: Keep Them at Bay^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Centurion Kaggrum^Centurion Kaggrum^^^^Defeat 10 Alliance units or players in Venture Bay and return to Centurion Kaggrum.^This wretched Westfall Brigade is proving a tougher opponent than we'd thought. Though few in number
column2: they fight well and bravely
column3: but we cannot afford to wait them out. Conqueror Krenna's orders were to capture the port quickly. You must break the stalemate
column4: <name>. Find the enemy's marines and slaughter them until the resistance ceases. Only then will we be able to claim ownership of the port. Go quickly. We don't want to keep Conqueror Krenna waiting.

column1: Mystery of the Tome^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Cavalier Durkon^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^Secrets of the Scourge^^^Take the Flesh-bound Tome to High Commander Halford Wyrmbane at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight.^What can it be
column2: <name>? That was certainly no ordinary curse that the blasted lich put on you! <Durkon flips through the grisly pages of the tome.> I don't even know if I'm looking at it the right way. We must find out what information is held within this tome! <Durkon hands the book back to you.> The High Commander will know what to do. Take the flesh-bound tome to him and tell him exactly what happened here.

column1: Understanding the Language of Death^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^Inquisitor Hallard^Secrets of the Scourge^^A Righteous Sermon^Take the Flesh-bound Tome to Inquisitor Hallard at the Wintergarde Keep prison.^Take the book and follow the path leading up to the barracks. Once inside the barracks take the staircase down to the prison. At the prison you will find Inquisitor Hallard and our mayor
column2: Godfrey. I believe Godfrey might be the missing piece of this puzzle and Hallard the man to put it all together. Go now!

column1: A Righteous Sermon^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Inquisitor Hallard^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^^Understanding the Language of Death^Into Hostile Territory^Wait for Inquisitor Hallard to finish his Righteous Sermon and return to High Commander Halford Wyrmbane at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight with the information you uncover.^Godfrey Goodard
column2: once a righteous man and mayor of Wintergarde
column3: is now an agent of the Scourge. His transformation from man to undying ghoul has taken place slowly
column4: over time. He hears the call of the Lich King now and lives only to serve his master. But as with all Scourge
column5: Godfrey knows the language of death and with proper motivation
column6: will tell us what we need to know about the tome. Once you hear what you need to hear
column7: return to the High Commander at the front lines. I'll clean up here as needed.

column1: Smoke 'Em Out^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Sergeant Downey^Sergeant Downey^^^^Use the Smoke Bomb to drive 20 Venture Company Stragglers from their buildings and then report to Sergeant Downey.^There are still pockets of cowardly Venture Company men holed up in some of the buildings at the center of Venture Bay. I need every man I can spare out there fighting against the Horde
column2: but we can't allow those Venture Company stragglers to camp out in those buildings
column3: either. Maybe we can "convince" them to make for their ship. Take this smoke bomb and use it to smoke out the stragglers from their places in the bunkhouse
column4: sawmill
column5: or stables. Don't get too close
column6: though; they probably bite.

column1: Smoke 'Em Out^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Stone Guard Ragetotem^Stone Guard Ragetotem^^^^Use the Smoke Bomb to drive 20 Venture Company Stragglers from their buildings and then report to Stone Guard Ragetotem.^Not only is this port infested with sniveling Alliance cowards
column2: but to make matters worse
column3: there are still Venture Company employees holed up in some of the buildings. They're not worth the time it takes to kill and I can't spare the warriors anyway. Maybe we can "convince" them to make for their ship. Take this smoke bomb and use it to smoke out the stragglers from their places in the bunkhouse
column4: sawmill
column5: or stables. Don't get too close
column6: though; there's no telling what diseases they're carrying.

column1: Into Hostile Territory^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^Duke August Foehammer^Into Hostile Territory^Understanding the Scourge War Machine
column2: A Righteous Sermon^^Speak with Gryphon Commander Urik to secure a ride to Thorson's Post. Report to Duke August Foehammer when you arrive at Thorson's Post in Dragonblight.^You have done much to advance our efforts against the Scourge
column3: <name>. In fact
column4: the morale of all those who have come into contact with you soars! Such is your influence over the soldiers and citizenry of Wintergarde
column5: ally. And because of you we are now prepared to go on the offensive! You are to report to Duke August Foehammer
column6: across the Carrion Fields at Thorson's Post
column7: east of here. Gryphon Commander Urik at the gryphon station has prepared a special gryphon to drop you behind enemy lines. Go now!

column1: Steamtank Surprise^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Duke August Foehammer^Ambo Cash^Into Hostile Territory^^^Use an Alliance Steam Tank to destroy 6 Plague Wagons and deliver the 7th Legion Elites to Wintergarde Mausoleum. Speak with Ambo Cash inside the Wintergarde Mausoleum in Dragonblight should you succeed.^This is a seek and destroy mission. You'll be driving a tank into the Carrion Fields to dismantle Scourge plague wagons. With the tank comes a crew of three 7th Legion soldiers. All must survive if this mission is to succeed! You'll need to get in close to a plague wagon to unleash your engineer. Let them do their deed and move on to the next one. When the field is clear of plague wagons
column2: head to the mausoleum in front of the ruined keep and drop off the rest of your crew. Meet with Ambo Cash inside.

column1: Out of Body Experience^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Ruuna the Blind^Ruuna the Blind^Ruuna the Blind^^^Drink the Gossamer Potion near Ruuna's Crystal Ball and witness the Vision from the Past.^Ah
column2: you seek a vision of the past. You're a wise <race>. Every time someone drops by for a reading
column3: they seem to always ask about the future. When you get to be my age
column4: you learn that scrying the past
column5: more often than not
column6: is more useful. Drink this potion and peer into my crystal ball. Let us see what knowledge we can obtain.

column1: Ruuna's Request^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Ruuna the Blind^Ruuna the Blind^Ruuna the Blind^^^Ruuna the Blind wants you to obtain 4 handfuls of Gossamer Dust.^I will not charge you gold for my services
column2: for I can foresee that your actions are necessary and much hinges on what you learn today. I will
column3: however
column4: ask you to collect a reagent for me. Obtain gossamer dust from the fern feeder moths northeast of here. Do this and I will prepare a potion that will take you to the time and place where the events took place that you need to witness.

column1: Fate and Coincidence^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Ruuna the Blind^Sasha^Ruuna the Blind^^Sasha's Hunt
column2: Anatoly Will Talk^Speak to Sasha at the White Pine Trading Post.^There are two types of people in this world
column3: <name>. Those who believe in coincidence and those who don't. On the day I lost my eyesight I was given the gift of clairvoyance. I suppose you can guess what sort of person I am. Earlier today
column4: a young woman named Sasha was granted the same vision you were. You will want to talk to her. You'll find her directly east of here at the White Pine Trading Post
column5: on the way to Solstice Village.

column1: Anatoly Will Talk^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Sasha^Sasha^^Fate and Coincidence^A Sister's Pledge^Sasha at the White Pine Trading Post wants you to take the Tranquilizer Dart and use it on Tatjana in Solstice Village. Bring Tatjana back to the White Pine Trading Post.^My sister is here somewhere
column2: and I can't seem to get this monster to talk. He doesn't seem to care about his own well-being
column3: but I've an idea. I knew Anatoly's wife
column4: Tatjana
column5: from before the wolfcult arrived -- she was a horse-handler. Take this tranquillizer dart. Bring her back alive
column6: we're going to need her if we're to have any leverage with Anatoly. I will help you find the person behind all this once we save my sister.

column1: Defending Wyrmrest Temple^74^All^Dragonblight^Lord Afrasastrasz^Lord Afrasastrasz^A Strange Device^^^Afrasastrasz at Wyrmrest Temple has asked you to slay 3 Azure Dragons
column2: slay 5 Azure Drakes
column3: and to destabilize the Azure Dragonshrine while riding a Wyrmrest Defender into battle.^Emboldened by the overabundance of magic now flowing through the Azure Dragonshrine
column4: the blue dragonflight has dared to attack Wyrmrest Temple itself! I ask that you ride one of our defenders into battle to slay their dragons and drakes
column5: and to attack the eruption of ley line energies at the dragonshrine itself in order to destabilize it. Outside on the east and west terraces are wyrmrest defenders. Speak with one to ride it into battle. Without your help
column6: <name>
column7: we will surely lose.

column1: A Sister's Pledge^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Sasha^Anya^^Anatoly Will Talk^Hour of the Worg^Look for Anya in the Duskhowl Den near Solstice Village.^Please
column2: <name>. I know it is Arugal you're after. I swear on my father's memory I will help you take him down. But I must beg you... Anya is completely innocent
column3: we cannot leave her with these savages. Help me rescue my sister and you'll have me at your side when you face Arugal. I know the den Anatoly spoke of. We'll find it on the other side of this hill. Let's go
column4: my sister's in danger.

column1: My Enemy's Friend^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Conqueror Krenna^Conqueror Krenna^The Flamebinders' Secrets^^^Conqueror Krenna in Conquest Hold wants you to slay 8 Silverbrook Hunters and their leader
column2: Vladek
column3: at the Forest's Edge Post.^If there is one thing I can get through your head
column4: let it be this: the Alliance will be crushed in the Grizzly Hills. There is far too much lumber
column5: ore
column6: game and strategic territory for us to give up on any single battlefront here. So far we've been successful... but there's something that could tip the scales in our enemy's favor. Far to the east of here
column7: at the Forest Edge's Post
column8: local trappers seek to join the Alliance. Slaughter them before they have the chance to do so.

column1: Attack on Silverbrook^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Conqueror Krenna^Conqueror Krenna^The Flamebinders' Secrets^^Vordrassil's Fall
column2: The Darkness Beneath
column3: The Conquest Pit: Bear Wrestling!^Conqueror Krenna at Conquest Hold wants you to slay 8 Silverbrook Defenders in the Silverbrook Hills.^A few hours ago
column4: the trappers were nothing but peasants threatening to add their number to the Alliance's. Now they've become something else... an uncertainty. I do not like uncertainties. Go to the hills outside their main town in northern Grizzly Hills
column5: Silverbrook
column6: and help my men crush them.

column1: Mounting Up^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Squire Percy^Squire Percy^^^^Ride 5 Highland Mustangs back to Squire Percy at the Westfall Brigade Encampment.^Cap'n Stoutmantle left most of our calvary... cavlary... uh
column2: horsemen at the fight for Venture Bay. We chose a good place to put the camp 'cause there are tons of highland mustangs running around near here and in the Boulder Hills to the northeast. The Cap'n put me in charge of capturing some of 'em. Will you help? I've got a stick and some string
column3: and there are loads of wild carrots growing near the camp. Pick the carrots and use them with the stick to lure in the mustang
column4: then ride it back here.

column1: The Horse Hollerer^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Soulok Stormfury^Soulok Stormfury^^^^Scare 15 Highland Mustangs and return to Soulok Stormfury at Camp Oneqwah.^The Alliance's 'Westfall Brigade' is camped far to the north
column2: near Thor Modan. They have foolishly divided their forces to contest our control of Venture Bay
column3: and they have been left without cavalry. They're now trying to capture and tame the wild highland mustangs that roam the area around the Westfall Brigade Encampment and Boulder Hills. We must stop them before they're able to replace their lost mounts. Take this and throw it near the horses to drive them away.

column1: Heated Battle^74^Alliance^Dragonblight^Ceristrasz^Ceristrasz^A Strange Device^^^Aid Captain Iskandar in holding the canyons by participating in the death of 12 Frigid Ghoul Attackers
column2: 8 Frigid Geist Attackers
column3: and 1 Frigid Abomination Attacker.^The Scourge have overrun the shrine. The shrine's keeper
column4: Dahlia Suntouch
column5: is nowhere to be found. The red wyrms that fell in the shrine's defense now beset us in the form of twisted skeletal emberwyrms. The situation is dire
column6: <race>. Captain Iskandar leads a group of your kind in stemming the flow of the Scourge out of the shrine. Go to his aid... but please stay behind his men. The flow of Scourge is endless and I don't want to lose you in one of those scarred canyons.

column1: Return to the Earth^74^Alliance^Dragonblight^Ceristrasz^Ceristrasz^A Strange Device^^^Enter the Ruby Dragonshrine through one of the northern or southern passes and search for Ruby Acorns. Use the Ruby Acorns on the fallen red dragons to return their bodies to the earth. Return to Ceristrasz once the task is complete.^I have another task that needs attention. I have brothers who are falling in the battle overhead and if we do not act quickly
column2: they will only bolster the emberwyrm ranks. Get into the shrine through one of the other passes to the south or north... the Scourge presence should be lighter there. Search the shrine for ruby acorns that have fallen from the tree and plant them near the bodies of my fallen brood. Through this
column3: they can give new life... a proud fate for any of my kind.

column1: Through Fields of Flame^75^Alliance^Dragonblight^Ceristrasz^Ceristrasz^A Strange Device^^^Enter the Ruby Dragonshrine through one of the northern or southern passes
column2: then kill 6 Frigid Necromancers and eliminate the source of the corruption under the shrine. Return to Ceristrasz once the task is complete.^I have one final task for you
column3: <race>... one that should turn the tide of this fight. Return to the shrine and kill the necromancers that are fueling this onslaught. With them dead
column4: we should be able to beat these forces back and eventually retake the shrine. I also need you to find the source of the corruption under the shrine and put an end to it. I know I have asked a lot of you
column5: but if you do this for me
column6: we will win this battle.

column1: The Fate of the Ruby Dragonshrine^75^All^Dragonblight^Ruby Brooch^Krasus^^^^Bring Dahlia Suntouch's Ruby Brooch to Krasus in the Ruling Council Chamber at Wyrmrest and inform him of Dahlia's fate.^As you pick up the brooch
column2: its faint glow brightens slightly. Krasus will want to know of Dahlia's fate. Take the brooch to him at Wyrmrest.

column1: Tactical Clemency^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Gorgonna^Captured Trapper^Mikhail's Journal^^The Conquest Pit: Bear Wrestling!^Deliver the Letter of Amnesty to the Captured Trapper in Silverbrook Hills.^Listen
column2: <name>. I need you to act with discretion and speed. One of Krenna's top sergeants has captured a trapper outcast outside of Silverbrook. Now
column3: if things turn out the way they usually do
column4: the prisoner is going to be executed before the day is over. We can't let that happen. You see
column5: the prisoner matches the description of Mikhail's older daughter in his diary. If we set her loose and follow her closely
column6: she'll lead us to whoever's controlling the trappers. Take this letter to her.

column1: Mikhail's Journal^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Mikhail's Journal^Conqueror Krenna^Mikhail's Journal^^^Bring Mikhail's Journal to Conqueror Krenna in Conquest Hold.^From what you can gather
column2: this journal was written by a denizen of Silverbrook named Mikhail. It is written in some variant of the common human tongue. Perhaps you should bring this back to Conqueror Krenna.

column1: Gorgonna^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Conqueror Krenna^Gorgonna^Mikhail's Journal^^^Bring Mikhail's Journal to Gorgonna in Conquest Hold.^This book is written in the pig-tongue the humans use. It needs to be burned immediately. Hand it to my sister Gorgonna and do not waste my time.

Ruuna the Blind^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Gorgonna^Ruuna the Blind^Ruuna the Blind^^^Speak to Ruuna the Blind at Ruuna's Camp near Vordrassil Pass.^This trapper business has the potential to be more important than we've accounted for. If they're not with the Alliance
column2: there's a good chance they're with the Scourge
column3: which could mean trouble. Our previous efforts might've paid off
column4: though. We spotted our former captive meeting with a fortune teller of some sort before we lost track of her. I'm almost certain now that she will take us to their leader if we can find her again. Find Ruuna the Blind and see what you can find out.

column1: The Conquest Pit: Bear Wrestling!^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Grennix Shivwiggle^Bookie Vel'jen^Gray Worg Hides^Delivery to Krenna
column2: Attack on Silverbrook
column3: Tactical Clemency^^Defeat Ironhide inside the Conquest Pit and speak to Bookie Vel'jen for a reward.^So you're interested in the fights
column4: eh? Well
column5: Krenna has outlawed pit-fighting for all enlisted combatants. But you
column6: my friend
column7: are technically a free agent and are not included in this prohibition. Nice loophole
column8: eh? Anyway
column9: if you're interested I can start you off with something easy
column10: a measly bear. I'll even let you bring friends along!

column1: The Conquest Pit: Mad Furbolg Fighting^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Grennix Shivwiggle^Bookie Vel'jen^Gray Worg Hides^^The Conquest Pit: Blood and Metal^Defeat Torgg Thundertotem inside the Conquest Pit and speak to Bookie Vel'jen for a reward.^You're not bad. Not bad at all. Think you can take a furbolg? What about one of those extra-large crazed Northrend furbolgs? Good
column2: good. Get your crew together
column3: and head to the ring. Let's give these folks a show... maybe we can earn some more coin while we're at it.

column1: The Conquest Pit: Blood and Metal^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Grennix Shivwiggle^Bookie Vel'jen^^The Conquest Pit: Mad Furbolg Fighting^The Conquest Pit: Death Is Likely^Defeat Rustblood inside the Conquest Pit and speak to Bookie Vel'jen for a reward.^It's nice to have a real fighter around these parts... we'd only had prisoners and caged beasts for the past few weeks. The people get bored
column2: ya know? Anyhow
column3: your next challenge is a genuine iron golem stolen from the depths of Thor Modan... think you can swing it?

column1: The Conquest Pit: Death Is Likely^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Grennix Shivwiggle^Bookie Vel'jen^^The Conquest Pit: Blood and Metal^The Conquest Pit: Final Showdown^Defeat Horgrenn Hellcleave inside the Conquest Pit and speak to Bookie Vel'jen for a reward.^I'm gonna shoot straight with ya
column2: kid. This next contender's a murderer. Literally. He was to be executed last week
column3: but he strangled the hangman with his left hand
column4: so Krenna's guards sort of let me have him. Feel free to pass on this one. I wouldn't blame ya.

column1: The Conquest Pit: Final Showdown^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Grennix Shivwiggle^Gorgonna^^The Conquest Pit: Death Is Likely^^Defeat Krenna in the Conquest Pit and speak to Gorgonna for a reward.^You must've really upset Krenna. She and Gorgonna have had a spat and you're wanted in the pit immediately. There are some wild rumors that it's a fight to the death! That would be bad news for you
column2: but great news for our business venture! At any rate
column3: you can't run away from fate... best get in there on the quick and get it over with.

column1: Riding the Red Rocket^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^General Gorlok^General Gorlok^^^^General Gorlok at the lighthouse in Venture Bay wants you to destroy the Alliance Lumber Boat.^You there
column2: <race>! Get your lousy carcass over here! The Alliance have a shipment of lumber all ready for transport just northeast of here. Since getting our hands on that wood is out of the question
column3: there's only one thing to do - destroy it! The goblin at the end of the dock here has some torpedoes all ready to go. He's got all the fuel for them on the docked goblin ship to the north. Get some fuel
column4: then commandeer one of the torpedoes and ride it into their ship. Dismissed!

column1: Seeking Solvent^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Gurtor^Gurtor^^^^Gurtor at the Venture Bay Horde base wants you to bring him a canister of Element 115.^Gah! Not again. Another blown gasket.... Every time one of these goes
column2: lubricant gums up all of the gears. Without solvent
column3: it takes hours to clean. Tell ya what
column4: <race>. There's some fancy rocket fuel on the Venture Company barge in the dock there - element 115 I think they call it. That stuff makes for a great solvent. Get me one of those and I'll make it worth your trouble.

column1: Report to Lord Afrasastrasz^74^All^Dragonblight^Alexstrasza the Life-Binder^Lord Afrasastrasz^A Strange Device^^^Speak with Lord Afrasastrasz at Wyrmrest Temple.^I abhor the loss of life... any life. But I will not stand idly by and allow Malygos to kill us and defile the temple! I have appointed Lord Afrasastrasz as the commander of Wyrmrest's defenses. Speak with Torastrasza to ride a drake down to him. Please lend him your aid
column2: <name>. Your involvement with the defense of Wyrmrest will be critical to us prevailing against the blue dragonflight.

column1: Supplemental Income^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Provisioner Lorkran^Provisioner Lorkran^^^^Provisioner Lorkran at Conquest Hold wants you to obtain 5 Succulent Venison from the nearby Tallhorn Stag.^Hail
column2: <class>. You'll find that here at Conquest Hold
column3: we buy and sell what Krenna wants us to buy and sell... at the price that Krenna wants us to buy and sell. All this is stifling business. I'm hoping to make a little bit of coin on the side and feed our grunts at the same time. Why don't you go hunt down some stag and bring me the venison? They're numerous in the area
column4: so bring me only the best meat.

column1: Riding the Red Rocket^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Commander Howser^Commander Howser^^^^Commander Howser at the lighthouse in Venture Bay wants you to destroy the Horde lumber shipment.^Listen
column2: <name>. This battle is as much over resources as tactical supremacy. I have a mission that could turn the tide in our struggle against the Horde here. There are torpedoes at the end of the dock that we can use to take down the Horde's lumber ship to the northwest. You'll need to get some of the fuel that's stored on the docked goblin ship just north of here
column3: then ride one of the torpedoes into their transport!

column1: Wanted: Kreug Oathbreaker^74^Alliance^Dragonblight^Wanted!^Highlord Leoric Von Zeldig^^Return to the High Commander^^Kill Kreug Oathbreaker and return to Highlord Leoric Von Zeldig at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight to collect your reward.^Posted by: Illusia Lune The Scourge flesh giant known as Kreug Oathbreaker was responsible for the deaths of my husband
column2: children and my dear friends
column3: the Whisperveils. Those brave enough to take on this bounty will find Kreug in the southeastern reaches of the Carrion Fields. I demand justice! Kill Kreug Oathbreaker! In the event that Kreug is slain
column4: I have pooled money and items together and given them to Highlord Leoric Von Zeldig to give out as a reward. Please vindicate us!

column1: A Disturbance In The West^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Vas the Unstable^Rodney Wells^A Disturbance In The West^^To Stars' Rest!^Speak to Rodney Wells at Wintergarde Keep to secure a ride to Stars' Rest in western Dragonblight.^Another force threatens to destroy all that we have worked for
column2: <name>. You must head westward to Stars' Rest. Archmage Modera has sensed a great disturbance in the magical ley lines of our world that must be dealt with immediately! Go now
column3: <name>! Speak to Rodney Wells at the gryphon station here in Wintergarde and let him know the nature of your mission. He will place you on his fastest gryphon to deliver you to Stars' Rest. Speak with Archmage Modera when you arrive.

column1: To Stars' Rest!^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Rodney Wells^Image of Archmage Modera^A Disturbance In The West^^Rifle the Bodies^Speak with the Image of Archmage Modera at Stars' Rest in western Dragonblight.^When you are ready I will place you on my fastest gryphon to Stars' Rest. Once you get there
column2: find and speak with Archmage Modera. Good luck
column3: ally!

column1: Wanted: High Shaman Bloodpaw^74^Alliance^Dragonblight^Wanted!^Highlord Leoric Von Zeldig^^Return to the High Commander^^Kill High Shaman Bloodpaw and return to Highlord Leoric Von Zeldig at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight to collect your reward.^Posted by: Drolfy While out in the Eldritch Heights with my cousins
column2: Skrotee and Brote
column3: a vicious band of wolvar from the Bloodpaw tribe attacked us. We attempted to flee
column4: but I fear they got Skrotee and Brote. I demand retribution! Is there someone brave enough to venture to the southeastern reaches of Dragonblight
column5: to the Eldritch Heights
column6: and kill High Shaman Bloodpaw and his cronies? I have given a hefty sum of gold to Highlord Leoric Von Zeldig to disperse to anyone that claims this bounty!

column1: Wanted: Onslaught Commander Iustus^74^Alliance^Dragonblight^Wanted!^Highlord Leoric Von Zeldig^^Return to the High Commander^^Kill Onslaught Commander Iustus and return to Highlord Leoric Von Zeldig at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight to collect your reward.^Posted by: Highlord Leoric Von Zeldig Upon the northeastern path from Wintergarde a battalion of 7th Legion were ambushed and slain by Onslaught Commander Iustus and an army of mindless Scarlet Onslaught zealots. Such cold and calculated actions must be met with force! Wintergarde demands justice! Seek out Onslaught Commander Iustus at Onslaught Base Camp to the northeast and end his miserable existence. I will hand out the reward for this bounty to any who would dare take up the task!

Seeking Solvent^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Barblefink^Barblefink^^^^Barblefink at the Alliance base in Venture Bay wants you to bring him a canister of Element 115.^Gah! Not again. Another blown gasket.... Every time one of these goes
column2: lubricant gums up all of the gears. Without solvent
column3: it takes hours to clean. Tell ya what
column4: <race>. There's some fancy rocket fuel on the Venture Company barge in the dock there - element 115 I think they call it. That stuff makes for a great solvent. Get me one of those and I'll make it worth your trouble.

column1: Blackriver Skirmish^74^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Scout Captain Carter^Scout Captain Carter^^^^Scout Captain Carter wants you to kill 10 Horde units or players in the Blackriver Logging Camp.^The Venture Company's on its way out of Grizzly Hills. They used to run logging operations here
column2: but things got a little too dangerous for them. Their abandoned sites are up for grabs and we sure as hell can't let the Horde get their hands on them. The Blackriver Logging Camp is the smallest of the three logging sites in this zone
column3: but we still need it. Do your part and fend off the Horde forces. Any lumber they get here will be made into weapons to be used against us elsewhere.

column1: The Obsidian Dragonshrine^74^All^Dragonblight^Nalice^Serinar^^^No Place to Run
column2: No One to Save You^Travel to the Obsidian Dragonshrine Northwest of Wymrest and just West of the Wrath Gate. Locate Serinar inside of the shrine and offer him your aid.^The Scourge come. Korialstrasz calls upon his allies in a futile attempt to save their Ruby Dragonshrine
column3: but it seems the good graces of the red flight don't extend to saving the shrines of the other flights. Surprised? I'm not. There is another of my brood who has left to clear our Obsidian Dragonshrine of the undead vermin that now infest it. All it would take to prove yourself more noble and righteous than Alexstrasza herself is a quick jaunt over there and a few swings of a blade. I'm amused.

column1: Heated Battle^74^Horde^Dragonblight^Vargastrasz^Vargastrasz^A Strange Device^^^Aid Captain Drayzen in holding the canyons by participating in the death of 12 Frigid Ghoul Attackers
column2: 8 Frigid Geist Attackers
column3: and 1 Frigid Abomination Attacker.^The Scourge have overrun the shrine. The shrine's keeper
column4: Dahlia Suntouch
column5: is nowhere to be found. The red wyrms that fell in the shrine's defense now beset us in the form of twisted skeletal emberwyrms. The situation is dire
column6: <race>. Captain Drayzen leads a group of your kind in stemming the flow of the Scourge out of the shrine. Go to his aid... but please stay behind his men. The flow of Scourge is endless and I don't want to lose you in one of those scarred canyons.

column1: Return to the Earth^74^Horde^Dragonblight^Vargastrasz^Vargastrasz^A Strange Device^^^Enter the Ruby Dragonshrine through the southern pass and search for Ruby Acorns. Use the Ruby Acorns on the fallen red dragons to return their bodies to the earth. Return to Vargastrasz once the task is complete.^I have another task that needs attention. I have brothers who are falling in the battle overhead and if we do not act quickly
column2: they will only bolster the emberwyrm ranks. Get into the shrine through the pass in the south... the Scourge presence should be lighter there. Search the shrine for ruby acorns that have fallen from the tree and plant them near the bodies of my fallen brood. Through this
column3: they can give new life... a proud fate for any of my kind.

column1: Through Fields of Flame^75^Horde^Dragonblight^Vargastrasz^Vargastrasz^A Strange Device^^^Enter the Ruby Dragonshrine through the southern pass
column2: then kill 6 Frigid Necromancers and eliminate the source of the corruption under the shrine. Return to Vargastrasz once the task is complete.^I have one final task for you
column3: <race>... one that should turn the tide of this fight. Return to the shrine and kill the necromancers that are fueling this onslaught. With them dead
column4: we should be able to beat these forces back and eventually retake the shrine. I also need you to find the source of the corruption under the shrine and put an end to it. I know I have asked a lot of you
column5: but if you do this for me
column6: we will win this battle.

column1: Onward to Camp Oneqwah^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Sergeant Nazgrim^Scout Vor'takh^^^^Speak with Scout Vor'takh at Camp Oneqwah.^While we build Conquest Hold
column2: I sent Scout Vor'takh to make contact with our taunka allies in the east. They're based in Camp Oneqwah
column3: which is in the easternmost part of Grizzly Hills
column4: beyond Grizzlemaw. Make the journey there
column5: hear Vor'takh's report and offer your assistance with anything he and the local chieftain may need. Your contributions to Conquest Hold have been exemplary and I know Vor'takh will be grateful for the assistance.

column1: Eyes Above^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Windseer Grayhorn^Windseer Grayhorn^^^^Windseer Grayhorn wants you to use the Silver Feather on 6 Imperial Eagles in Grizzly Hills.^I've been asked to lend my support to our efforts against the Alliance. At the moment our military forces are about evenly matched and we're looking for ways to find an edge. The imperial eagles that fly over the mountains and trees in this area would make excellent scouts for us. Take this silver feather and use it to bind my sight to that of them. Being able to see our enemy's movements will grant us the strategic advantage we need. You'll find abundant eagles in the mountains to the east.

Cycle of Life^74^All^Dragonblight^Nishera the Garden Keeper^Nishera the Garden Keeper^Cycle of Life^^^Nishera the Garden Keeper at the Emerald Dragonshrine has asked you to slay 5 Emerald Skytalons.^Ysera sleeps in the Emerald Dream
column2: watching over both the Dream and Azeroth. But a horrible nightmare has taken hold in the Dream
column3: and now I fear that Ysera is being affected by it. Recently
column4: I asked her to aid in the fight against the Scourge that are raising frostwyrms at the other dragonshrines. She misunderstood. Instead
column5: she told our dragonshrine's defenders to treat those not of the green dragonflight as enemies. I need you to slay some of the skytalons. The shrine must regain its balance.

column1: Scattered To The Wind^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Ambo Cash^Ambo Cash^Into Hostile Territory^^^Ambo Cash at the Wintergarde Mausoleum in Dragonblight wants you to recover 8 Wintergarde Munitions.^The munitions drop went badly
column2: friend. The shipment of ammo from Westguard Keep was intercepted by the frostwyrms circling overhead. The flying machines were torn apart in a matter of seconds and their cargo was scattered to the wind. Most of it is still topside - on the Carrion Fields. I'm gonna need you to go back up and recover the munitions crates that are scattered all over this damned place. Hurry it up! We can't start this offensive without guns and ammo
column3: <buddy/missy>!

column1: The Plume of Alystros^74^All^Dragonblight^Nishera the Garden Keeper^Nishera the Garden Keeper^Cycle of Life^^^Nishera the Garden Keeper at the Emerald Dragonshrine has asked you to acquire The Plume of Alystros.^I can feel that the shrine is not completely back in balance. The verdant keeper has been angered by our actions
column2: and I sense that he will not listen to reason. Alystros is an immense skytalon who perches at the south end of the Emerald Dragonshrine. It is he who is in charge of the dragonshrine's aerial defenses. I fear that we will have to deal with him. Take these skytalon molts and place them on the ground where he can see them. He will come. Bring me his plume.

column1: The Chain Gun And You^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Ambo Cash^Ambo Cash^Into Hostile Territory^^^Ambo Cash at the Wintergarde Mausoleum in Dragonblight wants you to save 8 Injured 7th Legion Soldiers.^We've set up chain guns and barricades directly to the east and to the west. Our injured soldiers are hiding in both rooms - trying their best to not alert the mindless ghouls to their presence. Now that we have ammo
column2: I need you to man one of the chain guns and use it to blast a path clear for our soldiers! Once you're on board
column3: call a soldier out from hiding and then lay down heavy fire to keep the Scourge off him! Get a move on!

column1: Seeds of the Lashers^74^All^Dragonblight^Lord Itharius^Lord Itharius^Seeds of the Lashers^^^Lord Itharius at the top of Wyrmrest Temple has asked you to return with 3 Lasher Seeds.^We need more weapons in the fight against the Scourge. The natural properties of the Emerald Dragonshrine to the southeast may be the answer. Any unliving creature
column2: save those that Sylvanas has redeemed
column3: that steps foot in the dragonshrine falls to dust. I want to test a theory
column4: and I want you to be my instrument in doing so
column5: young <race>. Go to the Emerald Dragonshrine and take the seeds from the emerald lashers therein.

column1: That Which Creates Can Also Destroy^74^All^Dragonblight^Lord Itharius^Lord Itharius^Seeds of the Lashers^^^Lord Itharius at the top of Wyrmrest Temple has asked you to destroy a Weakened Reanimated Frost Wyrm
column2: Weakened Turgid the Vile
column3: and Weakened Overseer Deathgaze.^Since we only have three seeds
column4: we must put them to the best possible use. Your targets are one of the reanimated frost wyrms circling to the north near Galakrond's Rest
column5: Turgid the Vile in the ruined barracks at the Carrion Fields to the east
column6: and Overseer Deathgaze at Jintha'kalar far to the northeast. While the seeds would outright destroy one of the lesser Scourge
column7: they will greatly weaken these three. Enough so
column8: in fact
column9: that you should be able to handle them on your own.

column1: Report to the Ruby Dragonshrine^74^Alliance^Dragonblight^Lauriel Trueblade^Ceristrasz^A Strange Device^^^Report to Ceristrasz on the ridge east of the Ruby Dragonshrine
column2: west of Wyrmrest.^We need you at the Ruby Dragonshrine. The dragons are beset on all sides by the blue flight and the scourge... they're in no better a state than we are. The situation seems dire
column3: but this affords us a rare opportunity to establish a valuable alliance. I secured a regiment to aid the red dragonflight against the Scourge at the Ruby Dragonshrine. If you have a fight in you
column4: please go find Ceristrasz on the ridge east of the shrine and help him in any way that you can.

column1: Report to the Ruby Dragonshrine^74^Horde^Dragonblight^Golluck Rockfist^Vargastrasz^A Strange Device^^^Report to Vargastrasz on a ridge outside of the Ruby Dragonshrine
column2: just east of Agmar's Hammer.^You are leaving to the Ruby Dragonshrine. This is not a request. The dragons are beset on all sides by the blue flight and the scourge... they're in no better a state than we are. It is not often we are afforded the opportunity to redeem ourselves for the transgressions of our ancestors. I have secured a regiment to aid the red dragonflight against the Scourge at the Ruby Dragonshrine. Join them and crush the Scourge beneath your boots! For the Horde!

column1: Breaking Off A Piece^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Yord "Calamity" Icebeard^Yord "Calamity" Icebeard^^^^Yord "Calamity" Icebeard at the Wintergarde Mausoleum in Dragonblight wants you to kill Necrolord X'avius
column2: Necrolord Horus
column3: and 15 Naxxramas Scourge.^Just down the steps lies the gateway to damnation: Scourge as far as the eye can see and getting thicker with each passing moment. What little intelligence we've been able to gather indicates that two Scourge necrolords are furiously working at emptying the first two crypts down below. Before we can breach the inner chamber to Thel'zan
column4: we'll need to take care of those two clowns and their Naxxramas cronies. Go down into the mausoleum and take out the necrolords and the Naxxramas dreadguards and shades.

column1: Plunderbeard Must Be Found!^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Ambo Cash^Plunderbeard^Into Hostile Territory^^^Ambo Cash at the Wintergarde Mausoleum in Dragonblight wants you to find Plunderbeard.^There's been talk of a tunnel dug by Scourge that connects the embalming chambers of the mausoleum with the large crypts
column2: now unearthed by Thel'zan and his minions. I recently sent my best rogue
column3: Plunderbeard
column4: in search of answers
column5: but have yet to hear back from him. If I were a betting man I'd wager that he's a goner. I want you to go down those steps and head straight through the embalming chamber and look for Plunderbeard. Dead or alive
column6: he'll have answers.

column1: My Old Enemy^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Commander Eligor Dawnbringer^Commander Eligor Dawnbringer^^Return to the High Commander^^Deliver The High General's Head to Commander Eligor Dawnbringer at Wintergarde Keep.^My old enemy
column2: High General Abbendis
column3: has come to Northrend. Somehow she survived the attacks upon Tyr's Hand and brought a small force north. They've established New Hearthglen to the south. While they could prove useful in fighting the Scourge
column4: Abbendis herself is far too shrewd an opponent to let live. Trust me
column5: if we let them stand
column6: she will be at our throats before the dust settles. So
column7: we'll deprive them of their leadership and go about our business. Bring me her head as proof.

column1: Plunderbeard's Journal^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Plunderbeard^Ambo Cash^Into Hostile Territory^^^Recover Page 4 of Plunderbeard's Journal
column2: Page 5 of Plunderbeard's Journal
column3: Page 6 of Plunderbeard's Journal
column4: and Page 7 of Plunderbeard's Journal and return them to Ambo Cash at the Wintergarde Mausoleum in Dragonblight.^Whatever was written on the remaining pages of Plunderbeard's journal must be recovered. Search the chambers located on the other side of this tunnel for Plunderbeard's assailants. They must be the ones who tore the journal apart! Should you recover the missing pages
column5: return them to Ambo Cash at the entrance of the Wintergarde Mausoleum.

column1: Chasing Icestorm: The 7th Legion Front^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Ambo Cash^Legion Commander Tyralion^Into Hostile Territory^^^Report to Legion Commander Tyralion at the 7th Legion Front in central Dragonblight.^You need to get to the 7th Legion Front in northern Dragonblight. Return to Wintergarde Keep and take the north gate out of town. Keep north until you hit a road. Take a left on that road and follow it until you reach the snowline. Once at the snowline keep heading west until you hit the Path of the Titans. Follow that north and it'll lead you right into the 7th Legion Front. Once there
column2: speak with Legion Commander Tyralion. He'll be expecting you. And <name> - it has been a pleasure. Farewell.

column1: Chasing Icestorm: Thel'zan's Phylactery^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Legion Commander Tyralion^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^Into Hostile Territory^^^Recover Thel'zan's Phylactery from Icestorm and return it to High Commander Halford Wyrmbane at Wintergarde Keep.^Your frostwyrm is out there. <Tyralion points west.> And it's a big one! When you're ready to fight
column2: go speak with "Wyrmbait." He'll "fetch" her. Once Icestorm is close enough we'll chain her to the ground and finish her off! Hopefully
column3: with your help
column4: we'll be able to take her down and get you that phylactery. Once you've got the phylactery
column5: return to Wintergarde Keep and report to High Commander Halford Wyrmbane. He's been making preparations for the final showdown with Thel'zan.

column1: The Conqueror's Task^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Conqueror Krenna^Sergeant Nazgrim^The High Executor Needs You^^A Show of Strength^Speak to Sergeant Nazgrim in Conquest Hold.^The Horde is a magnificent war machine and you are nothing but a cog. I am in charge of securing fuel for this machine. If I fail
column2: the machine fails. Lumber
column3: ore
column4: water... it's all here and we want it. And so does the Alliance. Before we can move against the human scum
column5: we need to solidify our control over the western region. Speak to Sergeant Nazgrim about eradicating the vrykul in Voldrune and then maybe - if you turn out to not be a complete failure - we'll send you on further tasks.

column1: Return to Sender^74^All^Dragonblight^Nozzlerust Supply Runner^Xink^Return to Sender^^^Follow the ridge to the east and deliver the pack of explosives to Xink at Nozzlerust Post in northern Dragonblight.^Upon closer examination
column2: the goblin appears to have been running a pack full of explosives across the wastes for delivery. The harpy feathers half-buried in the snow nearby suggest how he met his ill fate. It appears that the goblin was bringing the explosives towards the Wrath Gate from somewhere to the east. It seems most prudent to follow the ridge back to the east and inform the sender of their runner's fate.

column1: Mystery of the Infinite^75^All^Dragonblight^Chromie^Chromie^^^Mystery of the Infinite
column2: Redux^Chromie
column3: at the top of Wyrmrest Temple
column4: has asked you to travel to the Bronze Dragonshrine. Once inside
column5: place the Hourglass of Eternity on the ground.^A time storm at the Bronze Dragonshrine to the northeast is keeping immortals from entering. The Infinite Dragonflight are in a fight inside with the defenders to wrest control of the dragonshrine. We must take this opportunity to gain information. You are not immortal. You can cross into the dragonshrine and use the Hourglass of Eternity. Protect the hourglass for long enough and the leader of the Infinite Dragonflight should be revealed. Be warned
column6: the Infinite Dragonflight will try to stop you!

column1: Cruelty of the Kvaldir^71^All^Borean Tundra^Captured Tuskarr Prisoner^Karuk^^^^Speak to Karuk about the Captured Tuskarr Prisoner.^I thank you for saving me
column2: <name>. The kvaldir are animals! They made us fight the other prisoners. It would've been more merciful to just kill us all. The youngling Karuk is still alive -- I noticed him arrive here. Tell him his father fought until the end.

column1: Finality^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^Legion Commander Yorik^Into Hostile Territory^^An End And A Beginning^Take Thel'zan's Phylactery to Legion Commander Yorik inside the Wintergarde Mausoleum in Dragonblight.^Thanks to your heroics
column2: Lord Fordragon has given the command to launch a full assault against Thel'zan. 7th Legion have made their way into the summoning chamber of the mausoleum and located what appears to be a gateway to hell. The only piece that's missing now is you. Take the phylactery and report to Legion Commander Yorik inside the Wintergarde Mausoleum. There is a tunnel that the Scourge dug out just outside the keep that you can take to get to Yorik quickly. Go now
column3: <name>! Lead us to victory!

column1: An End And A Beginning^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Legion Commander Yorik^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^An End And A Beginning^Finality^^Defeat Thel'zan the Duskbringer and report to High Commander Halford Wyrmbane at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight.^Every good story has a beginning and an ending
column2: <name>. While your story is far from over
column3: I'll be damned if it's not already turning out to be the stuff of legend! No matter what happens to us when this is all over
column4: what you've done at Wintergarde will be a tale told for years to come. Now
column5: ally
column6: when you are ready I will use the phylactery to coax Thel'zan out of hiding. Should we somehow succeed
column7: report the victory to High Commander Halford Wyrmbane at Wintergarde Keep.

column1: To Fordragon Hold!^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^Highlord Bolvar Fordragon^An End And A Beginning^^^Venture to Fordragon Hold in Dragonblight and speak with Highlord Bolvar Fordragon.^With the Naxxramas war machine stopped dead in its tracks the time has come for you to help our forces at Angrathar
column2: the Wrathgate. Nestled against the mountain in northern Dragonblight is our base of operations
column3: Fordragon Hold. It is there that Lord Fordragon awaits your arrival! Go now
column4: <name>! Take the north gate out of town and travel north by northwest until you arrive at your destination. Light protect you!

column1: What Secrets Men Hide^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Zelig the Visionary^Zelig the Visionary^Imprints on the Past^^^Zelig the Visionary at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight wants you to find the Onslaught Map and return it to him.^After the betrayal at the Forgotten Shore
column2: Prince Arthas - with Muradin in tow - began his quest for Frostmourne. Could the location of the cavern where Frostmourne was found be near? What secrets could it hold? While the orb has no answers for these questions
column3: it does show me something. To the northeast of Wintergarde Keep is an outpost built by the Scarlet Onslaught. Somewhere within that outpost is a map. The orb tells me that this map will be of great use to us. Retrieve it!

column1: The Return of the Crusade?^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Commander Lynore Windstryke^Commander Lynore Windstryke^^Parting Thoughts^^Commander Lynore Windstryke at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight wants you to kill 20 Scarlet Onslaught at the Onslaught Base Camp.^To the northeast of Wintergarde Keep is a newly built encampment
column2: set up by the Scarlet Crusade - or rather - the Scarlet Onslaught as they now call themselves. While we are unsure as to why they are in Northrend
column3: they are certainly no less dangerous than they were before. As of last night the Scarlet Onslaught has killed twelve of our soldiers. They must be taught a lesson
column4: <name>. Go to Onslaught Base Camp and thin them out.

column1: The Path of Redemption^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^High Commander Halford Wyrmbane^^Parting Thoughts^^Return "The Path of Redemption" to High Commander Halford Wyrmbane at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight.^"The Path of Redemption
column2: ever heard of it? It is allegedly a journal that holds the prophetic ramblings of High General Abbendis of the Scarlet Onslaught. Within that book can be found the motivations and goals of the Scarlet zealots - not to mention a whole lot of insanity. Venture to Onslaught Base Camp, northeast of Wintergarde Keep, and recover a copy of The Path of Redemption" from one of the Onslaught soldiers.

column1: Frostmourne Cavern^73^Alliance^Dragonblight^Zelig the Visionary^Zelig the Visionary^Imprints on the Past^^^Zelig the Visionary at Wintergarde Keep in Dragonblight wants you to use Zelig's Scrying Orb at the bottom of Frostmourne Cavern. Unlock the secrets of the past!^They have labeled the cave as Frostmourne Cavern. Why the Scarlet Onslaught is interested in such things is unknown
column2: but by the look of things
column3: the area surrounding the cave is heavily guarded. Nonetheless
column4: we must proceed! Take this scrying orb and travel north out of town and then northwest towards Scarlet Point. Make your way into the cave and battle your way to the bottom. Once there
column5: use the orb. Return here with what you discover.

column1: Adding Injury to Insult^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Lydell^Lydell^The Ambush^^^Read the Vrykul Insult to Bjorn Halgurdsson in Baleheim
column2: then lead him back to Lydell's Ambush and help slay him.^The vrykul are being clever about this. Fortunately I've a trick up my sleeve. This leader of theirs
column3: Bjorn
column4: is a real hothead. We've pieced together enough of their language to fashion what we think is a good insult. Something involving his mother and large barnyard animals... we're not quite sure. Take this piece of paper and read it to him. Once he starts chasing you
column5: lure him back here. We'll make sure he doesn't make it out alive.

column1: Against Nifflevar^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Ranger Captain Areiel^Ranger Captain Areiel^^^^Ranger Captain Areiel wants you to go to Nifflevar and slay 5 Dragonflayer Warriors
column2: 4 Dragonflayer Rune-Seers and 4 Dragonflayer Hunting Hounds.^We await reinforcements from Vengeance Landing to move against Nifflevar. If we were to capture it earlier
column3: though
column4: it would provide us with a great advantage over the Alliance. Head into town and see if you can put a dent in their numbers.

column1: Shimmercap Stew^75^All^Grizzly Hills^Prigmon^Prigmon^Shimmercap Stew^^^Prigmon in Granite Springs wants you to collect 5 Shimmering Snowcaps and 5 Ice Serpent Eyes from Drak'Zin Ruins and 5 Sweetroot from Zeb'Halak.^Say
column2: while yer here
column3: how bout ya help ol' Prigmon with a little chore? I got a friend who can make a mean stew - one like ya never tasted before! There be a few ingredients found in these parts that he be needin'. They be in ruins to the southwest and the camp just north o' here. Whatd'ya say
column4: mon?

column1: Scourgekabob^74^All^Grizzly Hills^Prigmon^Mack Fearsen^^Vial of Visions^Seared Scourge^Prigmon at Granite Springs wants you to bring a Mummified Troll Carcass to Mack Fearsen and place it in the fire.^Ugh. Wrappin' up these unfortunate trolls be makin' my heart ache
column2: but not so much as my back! Help ol' Prigmon out and haul one of these carcasses over to Mack. If we don't burn 'em they be walkin' again in no time.

column1: To Bor'gorok Outpost
column2: Quickly!^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Sauranok the Mystic^Spirit Talker Snarlfang^To Bor'gorok Outpost
column3: Quickly!^^^Speak with Spirit Talker Snarlfang at Bor'gorok Outpost.^Did you feel it? <Sauranok momentarily clutches his chest in confusion. His hand comes away trailing red-hot steam.> Something terrible has happened to my old friend
column4: Farseer Grimwalker. I just sensed it. He had a pupil that he took with him when he went north. They were going to help the overlord establish an outpost on the edge of Sholazar Basin. Her name is Snarlfang. She is a spirit talker. Perhaps she will know what happened. Or
column5: at least
column6: she can help you to find out.

column1: To Conquest Hold
column2: But Be Careful!^74^Horde^Grizzly Hills^High Executor Wroth^Conqueror Krenna^The High Executor Needs You^^^Present yourself to Conqueror Krenna at Conquest Hold in the Grizzly Hills.^I've received a request for help from our base in the Grizzly Hills. I'm sending you to see Conqueror Krenna. <The high executor waves a sheaf of parchment in the air as if he could care less what is written on it.> She's attempting to secure all of the natural resources or somesuch. Just watch your back around her. The word is that she's aggressive even for an orc. Follow the road east and then southeast. Cross the bridge at the Dragonspine Tributary and go east from the Evergreen Trading Post.

column1: The High Executor Needs You^74^Horde^Dragonblight^Senior Sergeant Juktok^High Executor Wroth^The High Executor Needs You^^^Speak with High Executor Wroth at Venomspite in Dragonblight.^It's a good thing that I intercepted this request from High Executor Wroth before it got to Overlord Agmar. What is Wroth thinking? <The sergeant rips up the letter that he's holding.> <class>
column2: go see what it is that the high executor wants. Follow the road east and pass through The Dragon Wastes. You'll find a path leading up out of the wastes on the southeast side
column3: and the Forsaken town
column4: Venomspite
column5: will stand before you on the south side of the mountain.

column1: Welcome to Sholazar Basin^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Monte Muzzleshot^Hemet Nesingwary^Where in the World is Hemet Nesingwary?^^^Follow the path to the northwest to reach the camp that Monte mentioned.^So
column2: where did you come from? I don't suppose that fool of an archmage sent you
column3: too? You're lucky to be in one piece
column4: <laddie/lass>! They nearly blew you up! The jungle here's a darned dangerous place
column5: 'specially with the Venture Company about.  Git you! Go see the boss... he'll sort you out. The camp's at the end of that path to the northwest. Now
column6: git!

column1: Audience With The Dragon Queen^74^Alliance^Dragonblight^Highlord Bolvar Fordragon^Alexstrasza the Life-Binder^An End And A Beginning^^Galakrond and the Scourge^Seek out Alexstrasza the Life-Binder at Wyrmrest Temple in Dragonblight.^Our assault against Angrathar has staggered the Scourge
column2: but they remain unrelenting. From overhead they send their frost wyrms to strafe the field of battle
column3: making an advance upon the gate itself impossible. The frost wyrm attacks must be stopped
column4: but before we defile the bones of ancient dragons
column5: we must gain permission from their queen. Travel southeast to Wyrmrest Temple and seek out Queen Alexstrasza. Tell her what we must do and ask her for guidance. Go now
column6: <name>!

column1: Audience With The Dragon Queen^74^Horde^Dragonblight^Saurfang the Younger^Alexstrasza the Life-Binder^The Kor'kron Vanguard!^^Galakrond and the Scourge^Seek out Alexstrasza the Life-Binder at Wyrmrest Temple in Dragonblight.^Though I know you hunger to destroy the Scourge that stand before us at the Wrath Gate
column2: we must first deal with the threat that looms overhead. Until the strafing assaults of the frost wyrms are halted
column3: we cannot move forward. But before we assault the dying grounds of dragons
column4: we must first be granted permission. Venture now to the hallowed halls of dragonkind: Wyrmrest Temple. Once there
column5: seek out Queen Alexstrasza. Ride now
column6: <name>! Southeast
column7: to Wyrmrest!

column1: Galakrond and the Scourge^74^All^Dragonblight^Alexstrasza the Life-Binder^Torastrasza^An End And A Beginning^^^Speak with Torastrasza at Wyrmrest Temple in Dragonblight.^Atop the Wicked Coil
column2: the Grand Necrolord of the Scourge
column3: Antiok
column4: sits upon the shoulders of the reconstructed storm giant lord
column5: Thiassi. From there he commands the armies of undead to work day and night to unearth Galakrond's massive bones. Should they succeed in raising Galakrond
column6: all of your efforts will have been for naught. While I cannot call down the full fury of the Red Dragonflight to assist you in your journey
column7: I will grant you my blessing. Go now and speak with my majordomo
column8: Torastrasza.

column1: On Ruby Wings^74^All^Dragonblight^Torastrasza^Alexstrasza the Life-Binder^An End And A Beginning^^Return To Angrathar
column2: Return To Angrathar^Destroy 30 Wastes Scavengers and recover the Scythe of Antiok. Return to Alexstrasza the Life-Binder at Wyrmrest Temple should you complete this task.^Use this beacon to signal a Wyrmrest vanquisher. Climb upon its back and fly north to Galakrond's Rest. Once there
column3: command the dragon to destroy the Scourge scavengers that work to unearth Galakrond. Once the area has been cleansed
column4: fly to the Wicked Coil
column5: overlooking Galakrond's Rest
column6: to destroy Grand Necrolord Antiok and recover the scythe that he uses to control the wyrms. Do this and return to Queen Alexstrasza for a hero's reward! <name>
column7: beware the rotting storm giants that wander the area!

column1: Return To Angrathar^74^Alliance^Dragonblight^Alexstrasza the Life-Binder^Highlord Bolvar Fordragon^^On Ruby Wings^^Speak with Highlord Bolvar Fordragon at Fordragon Hold and tell him of your victory over the Scourge.^With Antiok slain and the scythe in our possession
column2: the frost wyrm assaults upon your forces at Angrathar will halt. The wyrms that remain in the Dragonblight will be hunted and destroyed
column3: their bones returning to the earth. The time to make your final stand is now
column4: <name>. Return to Fordragon Hold and notify Highlord Fordragon.

column1: Return To Angrathar^74^Horde^Dragonblight^Alexstrasza the Life-Binder^Saurfang the Younger^^On Ruby Wings^^Speak with Saurfang the Younger at the Kor'kron Vangaurd and tell him of your victory over the Scourge.^With Antiok slain and the scythe in our possession
column2: the frost wyrm assaults upon your forces at Angrathar will halt. The wyrms that remain in the Dragonblight will be hunted and destroyed
column3: their bones returning to the earth. The time to make your final stand is now
column4: <name>. Return to the Kor'kron Vanguard and notify Saurfang the Younger.

column1: Troll Patrol^76^All^Zul'Drak^Commander Kunz^Commander Kunz^^Pa'Troll^^Commander Kunz at the Argent Stand wants you to visit the four Argent Crusade posts
column2: follow their captain's orders
column3: and then return and report to him.^Unsheathe that weapon
column4: <race>. It's time to go on patrol! I've got four posts under my command and it's crucial to our success that they remain in our control. I'm ordering you to visit each of them and offer your assistance. You can begin with Captain Brandon southeast of here. He'll direct you to the next post when he's finished with you. Report back to me once you've assisted each of my men. And remember
column5: you'll be more richly rewarded for returning to me quickly - so double-time it! Dismissed!

column1: Troll Patrol: High Standards^76^All^Zul'Drak^Captain Brandon^Captain Brandon^^^^Captain Brandon wants you to place the Argent Crusade Banner in the Drakkari Pedestals at Drak'Sotra.^Listen
column2: <class>. This is the Argent Crusade. Our men will fight to the end and never complain no matter what the conditions. That said
column3: we've taken some heavy casualties in this campaign and we've been hitting it hard with little or no sleep for months. That all takes a toll on morale
column4: whether we admit it or not. It may not seem like much
column5: but seeing our standard raised over the battlefield is of considerable comfort to a soldier. Take these banners and raise them at the pedestals in Drak'Sotra.

column1: Defend the Stand^76^All^Zul'Drak^Commander Falstaav^Commander Falstaav^Taking a Stand^^Pa'Troll^Commander Falstaav has tasked you with the destruction of any 10 Scourge in the courtyard at The Argent Stand.^Despite our substantial successes in the lower third of Zul'Drak
column2: we must still face the onslaught of the Scourge. Such is the way in this frigid hell. The attacks are unrelenting
column3: yet my men need rest. If you are willing
column4: we could use your aid in reinforcing them. Below in the courtyard you'll find no end to the fighting. Dispatch the Scourge there with all the zeal you can muster
column5: <class>.

column1: Argent Crusade
column2: We Are Leaving!^76^All^Zul'Drak^Sergeant Stackhammer^Sergeant Stackhammer^New Orders for Sergeant Stackhammer^^^Sergeant Stackhammer at the Altar of Sseratus wants you to speak with 10 of his Argent Soldiers and tell them to report back to him.^<The sergeant quickly reads through the orders you've handed him
column3: a frown coming over his face.> Look
column4: <lad /lass>
column5: I'd love to just up and leave
column6: but take a look out there. All of my people are fighting. Tell you what
column7: you've come this far
column8: you think you're up to doing me a small favor? Head out there and round up my soldiers? Tell 'em that the sergeant orders them to report back immediately. Lend them a hand if you will.

column1: New Orders for Sergeant Stackhammer^76^All^Zul'Drak^Commander Kunz^Sergeant Stackhammer^New Orders for Sergeant Stackhammer^Parachutes for the Argent Crusade^Mopping Up^Commander Kunz has asked you to deliver the New Deployment Orders to Sergeant Stackhammer at the Altar of Sseratus.^<class>
column2: you're here to help
column3: right? I've got new orders for our forces that are currently deployed at the Drakkari altar to the north. You can't miss it. Just head straight up the avenue. Sergeant Stackhammer shouldn't be hard to find.

column1: Trouble at the Altar of Sseratus^76^All^Zul'Drak^Hexxer Ubungo^Hexxer Ubungo^^Parachutes for the Argent Crusade^^Hexxer Ubungo at The Argent Stand has asked you to investigate the main altar building at the Altar of Sseratus.^There's trouble at the altar of the snake god. The presence of the Scourge has weakened the land
column2: <race>. This in turn has weakened the wild gods. We know that the Drakkari are taking advantage of this to do evil things to the gods. I need you to be my eyes and ears. The Altar of Sseratus is at the end of the avenue to the north. Sneak around the back and get a look inside of the main altar building. Whatever you do
column3: avoid the prophet at all costs!

column1: Strange Mojo^76^All^Zul'Drak^Strange Mojo^Hexxer Ubungo^Strange Mojo^^^Deliver the Strange Mojo to Hexxer Ubungo at The Argent Stand.^This bottle of strange mojo may be the key to what is truly going on here. The Zandalari troll Hexxer Ubungo
column2: back at The Argent Stand
column3: may want to take a look at it.

column1: Mopping Up^76^All^Zul'Drak^Corporal Maga^Corporal Maga^^New Orders for Sergeant Stackhammer^^Corporal Maga at the Altar of Sseratus wants you to kill any combination of 10 Champions of Sseratus
column2: Priests of Sseratus
column3: or Drakkari Snake Handlers.^I couldn't help but overhear what you were talking to the sergeant about. That doesn't change the fact that we still have a job to do here. While you're out there
column4: do you think you could help us to put some of those followers of Sseratus out of their misery?

column1: Troll Patrol: Intestinal Fortitude^76^All^Zul'Drak^Captain Rupert^Captain Rupert^^^^Captain Rupert in Drak'Sotra wants you to restore courage to the cowering Crusade Recruits.^Finally
column2: the patrol arrives! Here's the situation
