column3: <race>. We've lost many of our finest soldiers in this campaign and have had to call upon our recruits to fill in the gaps. We've just fought one of our fiercest battles and many of the recruits were simply not prepared to face this enemy. There are more fights ahead
column4: and I need them ready to follow orders. If there's one thing I can't stomach
column5: it's cowardice. Perhaps you can help them find the courage to continue.

column1: Precious Elemental Fluids^76^All^Zul'Drak^Hexxer Ubungo^Hexxer Ubungo^Strange Mojo^^^Hexxer Ubungo at The Argent Stand wants you to acquire 3 Precious Elemental Fluids.^<The hexxer examines the decanter of mojo.> I have an idea for how to deal with the prophet of Sseratus. But first
column2: we're going to need some things. The Drak'Sotra Fields are directly to the south. Because of the stresses on the land from the Scourge and the deaths of gods
column3: the wall between worlds has weakened and the elementals are flooding in. We need the precious fluids of their lords. If you combine three links from the elementals a tether will be made
column4: and one of their lords can be summoned.

column1: The Hills Have Us^73^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Gryphon Commander Urik^Lieutenant Dumont^^^^Report to Lieutenant Dumont at Amberpine Lodge in western Grizzly Hills.^While we focus to hold our ground at Wintergarde and deal with the unfolding events of the Wrathgate
column2: battalions from as far away as Westfall battle their way through the dense foliage and inhospitable denizens of Grizzly Hills. All in hopes of finding an alternate route into Icecrown. Lieutenant Dumont
column3: stationed at Amberpine Lodge
column4: has enlisted the aid of able bodied citizens willing to risk life and limb in the uncharted wilds. Will you rise to meet this challenge?

column1: Leave No One Behind^76^All^Zul'Drak^Dr. Rogers^Dr. Rogers^^^^Dr. Rogers at Drak'Sotra wants you to find Crusader Lamoof
column2: Crusader Jonathan
column3: and Crusader Josephine. Use the Crusader's Bandage on them
column4: and escort them safely back to him.^Ahh
column5: good. They sent someone. Listen
column6: <race>. We need a hand here. Our forces were pushed back and we've lost Drak'Sotra to the Scourge. Where they came from is anyone's guess.... The point is
column7: we need every man we can get here
column8: and some of our best have yet to return from battle. I need you to enter the ruins now that the fighting has died down and find our wounded
column9: patch them up
column10: and bring them here to me. Scour Drak'Sotra! They couldn't have gone far.

column1: Nice Hat...^68^All^Caverns of Time^Don Carlos^Don Carlos^^^^Don Carlos has inadvertently challenged you to defeat his younger self in Old Hillsbrad. Afterwards
column2: bring Don Carlos' Hat to him in Tanaris as proof.^My hat? Yes
column3: it's an unusual style
column4: I know
column5: from far away... few tailors here know how to make them. When I was young and hot-blooded
column6: I wore it as a standing challenge. Many came seeking to defeat me and win it for themselves... but no one ever did. Ah
column7: but those days are long past. I'm an old man
column8: now: I drink
column9: I fish
column10: but I no longer duel.

column1: Mushroom Mixer^76^All^Zul'Drak^Hexxer Ubungo^Hexxer Ubungo^Strange Mojo^^Too Much of a Good Thing^Collect 10 Muddlecap Fungus and deliver them to Hexxer Ubungo at The Argent Stand.^Now what we need is something to spike the mojo with. Something that'll make it so that when the prophet drinks it
column2: he'll become less powerful. Drak'Agal lies to the east. There's a mushroom there that the natives call muddlecap fungus. I think it's exactly what we need. Bring back lots of them. When we mix them into the mojo
column3: the mind of anyone who drinks it will become muddled.

column1: Too Much of a Good Thing^76^All^Zul'Drak^Hexxer Ubungo^Hexxer Ubungo^Too Much of a Good Thing^Mushroom Mixer^The Blessing of Zim'Torga^Slay the Muddled Prophet of Sseratus and then return to Hexxer Ubungo at The Argent Stand.^There. I've modified the mojo. Now when the prophet drinks it
column2: not only will he lose some of his power
column3: his mind will also be addled by the effects of the fungus. At least that's the theory. As for how to get him to drink it
column4: might I suggest you simply throw it at him? No doubt he'll catch and drink it given the arrogance that he's displayed at the altar. Unless you can kill him
column5: <class>
column6: your Argent Crusade is about to come to a terrible end.

column1: Troll Patrol: Whatdya Want
column2: a Medal?^76^All^Zul'Drak^Captain Grondel^Captain Grondel^^^^Captain Grondel outside the Coliseum wants you to gather 7 Drakkari Medallions from the nearby Drakkari Corpses.^Look at me
column3: <race>. Do I look like I have time fer fillin' out reports? It be all I can do to keep this post free o' the bloody Scourge
column4: and they want me to mess with paperwork! No sense in complainin'. I need to get the commander some kinda kill count from the last skirmish. You wanna be helpful? Go and get me all the medals you can find from the dead trolls around here. That'll hafta be close enough.

column1: Rhino Mastery: The Test^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Hemet Nesingwary^Hemet Nesingwary^Rhino Mastery: The Test^Wipe That Grin Off His Face^Crocolisk Mastery: The Trial^Kill 15 Shardhorn Rhinos and return to Hemet Nesingwary at the Nesingwary Base Camp.^No rough landing is going to stop ol' Hemet from mastering the largest game Sholazar has to offer. In the wilds northwest of the camp
column2: the jungles are ruled by the mighty shardhorn rhino. You can prove your worth to the expedition
column3: <lad/lass>
column4: by showing me that you're tough enough to face down those powerful beasts.

column1: Where in the World is Hemet Nesingwary?^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Archmage Pentarus^Monte Muzzleshot^Where in the World is Hemet Nesingwary?^^^Talk to Archmage Pentarus when you're ready to leave for Sholazar Basin. When you arrive
column2: speak with Monte Muzzleshot in the Wildgrowth Mangal of Sholazar Basin.^When I heard that the legendary Hemet Nesingwary was setting sail for the Sholazar Basin
column3: I offered to help fund his expedition. We know little of Sholazar
column4: but it's said to be a lush paradise in the midst of this frozen continent. Hemet has agreed to send back samples of exotic plants
column5: reagents
column6: and crystals. There hasn't been any word from him. Monte Muzzleshot was supposed to be bringing them supplies
column7: but he hasn't returned
column8: either. If you'll look into it
column9: I'll send you in my flying machine.

column1: Need an Engine
column2: Take an Engine^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Weslex Quickwrench^Weslex Quickwrench^Need an Engine
column3: Take an Engine^^^Weslex Quickwrench at the Nesingwary Base Camp wants you to bring him a Flying Machine Engine.^She's ruined... ruined! I told that captain to be careful with such a precious cargo
column4: but would she listen to me? No! When the ship ran aground
column5: it damaged my flying machine
column6: the Spirit of Gnomeregan. Now
column7: we're left without any means to send our reports! There is a chance
column8: though
column9: that the Venture Company's antics may work in our favor. They shot down another flying machine right about where Monte parachuted into the swamp to the east. Go there and retrieve the engine. It may be our only hope.

column1: Have a Part
column2: Give a Part^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Weslex Quickwrench^Weslex Quickwrench^Need an Engine
column3: Take an Engine^^Aerial Surveillance
column4: Aerial Surveillance^Bring 7 Venture Co. Spare Parts to Weslex Quickwrench at the Nesingwary Base Camp.^Great
column5: now that we've got an engine
column6: we're going to need an assortment of other parts to get her back in flying condition. Don't worry
column7: I know what I'm doing. A good mechanic can hold his creations together with anything
column8: but we're better off if it doesn't come to that. Anyway
column9: those Venture Company dullards have plenty of spare parts for their mining equipment all over Swindlegrin's Dig on the far side of that yellow crystal pillar to the northeast. Scoop up a few and bring them back here.

column1: Venture Co. Misadventure^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Debaar^Debaar^Venture Co. Misadventure^^^Debaar at the Nesingwary Base Camp wants you to kill 15 Venture Company members. You may kill either Venture Co. Ruffians or Venture Co. Excavators.^Ever since we arrived
column2: the Venture Company has hampered our efforts to secure our campsite and survey the area. Normally
column3: we wouldn't care what they were up to
column4: but they've started antagonizing our scouts and shooting down supply flights. We can't allow this insult to stand. Hemet Nesingwary's expedition came here to hunt
column5: and hunt it shall. Go to Swindlegrin's Dig
column6: on the far side of the crystal pillar to the northeast
column7: and kill any Venture Company employee you see!

column1: Wipe That Grin Off His Face^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Debaar^Debaar^Venture Co. Misadventure^^Rhino Mastery: The Test
column2: Dreadsaber Mastery: Becoming a Predator
column3: Kick
column4: What Kick?^Kill Foreman Swindlegrin and Meatpie and return to Debaar at the Nesingwary Base Camp.^We must send Foreman Swindlegrin packing if we're going to shut down his mine permanently
column5: but be careful. His bodyguard
column6: Meatpie
column7: is a large
column8: mean ogre
column9: and isn't likely to let you see the foreman without a fight. The two probably occupy a platform that would let them look out over the entire Venture Company operation at Swindlegrin's Dig. Remember
column10: the dig is on the far side of the Suntouched Pillar to the northeast. Good luck
column11: <name>.

column1: Rhino Mastery: The Chase^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Hemet Nesingwary^Oracle Soo-rahm^Rhino Mastery: The Test^^^Speak to Oracle Soo-rahm at the Bones of Nozronn.^Well
column2: that's settled then. We'll seek out this native sage and have a word with him. He's not likely to volunteer his services
column3: though. I'm told he keeps a small lean-to near the Bones of Nozronn
column4: just across the river to the south. Seek him out
column5: introduce yourself
column6: and ask what he requires to help us track down this patriarch of the rhinos.

column1: Gluttonous Lurkers^76^All^Zul'Drak^Apprentice Pestlepot^Alchemist Finklestein^^^^Deliver 5 Basilisk Crystals to Alchemist Finklestein in the shrine at Heb'Valok.^My master
column2: Finklestein
column3: is in the shrine at Heb'Valok to the northwest preparing a truth serum
column4: and he needs basilisk crystals. Heb'Valok is on the west side of the road leading north before the Altar of Sseratus. There are basilisks to the east at Drak'Agal. If you grab the Zul'Drak rats and throw them at the basilisk
column5: they will become gorged and docile after eating five. Then you'll be able to take their crystals. Killing the basilisk won't do you any good. That'd just break its crystals!

column1: Playing Along^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Tracker Gekgek^High-Shaman Rakjak^Playing Along^^Tormenting the Softknuckles^Report to High-Shaman Rakjak at Frenzyheart Hill as the new "slave."^My kill! You take my kill! <Gekgek taunts you with his spear.> You dumb
column2: <race>. Now you owe Gekgek! You be Frenzyheart slave. You slay many more beasts for Frenzyheart. You go Frenzyheart Hill to northeast - you tell High-Shaman Rakjak you the new slave. Go
column3: <race>! Go or I taunt you a second time! <Gekgek waves his spear around menacingly.>

column1: The Ape Hunter's Slave^77^All^Sholazar Basin^High-Shaman Rakjak^High-Shaman Rakjak^Playing Along^^The Wasp Hunter's Apprentice
column2: The Sapphire Queen^Kill 8 Hardknuckle Foragers and 6 Hardknuckle Chargers for High-Shaman Rakjak at Frenzyheart Hill.^You think you so great hunter
column3: eh? You no Frenzyheart
column4: you not know of hunt. Goregek is great ape hunter. He slay so many ape you can't count on claws. You go with Goregek and hunt hardknuckles to east. You the slave
column5: <race>. You do what Goregek tell you.

column1: Tormenting the Softknuckles^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Goregek the Gorilla Hunter^High-Shaman Rakjak^^Playing Along^The Wasp Hunter's Apprentice
column2: The Sapphire Queen^Goregek has given you a Softknuckle Poker for use on Softknuckles to draw the Hardknuckle Matriarch out of hiding. Slay the Hardknuckle Matriarch and report her death to High-Shaman Rajak at Frenzyheart Hill.^Slave thing! Rakjak want me to babysit you while I kill hardknuckles. I feeling generous today
column3: so I let you kill some too
column4: but don't get in Goregek's way! Rakjak not know yet
column5: but Goregek has eye on big bad hardknuckle mama. We go to Hardknuckle Clearing to east and poke softknuckles with poker and she sure to come yelling! <Goregek rubs his hands together gleefully.>

column1: The Underground Menace^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Elder Harkek^High-Shaman Rakjak^Flown the Coop!^^A Rough Ride^Locate Serfex under the sands of the southern river
column2: slay him
column3: and bring his claw to High-Shaman Rakjak at Frenzyheart Hill.^Lion killer
column4: chicken chaser
column5: new Frenzyheart slave... I know you no want to stay slave
column6: so I tell you what to do. Show you better than the other Frenzyheart hunters and then Rakjak respect you. Under sands of south river there a beast that kills wasp
column7: apes
column8: and even wolvar. He called Serfex. You bring claw of Serfex to Rakjak and maybe he release you from slaveness. Hope Dajik teaching you good so Serfex be easy stuff.

column1: Flown the Coop!^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Elder Harkek^Elder Harkek^Flown the Coop!^The Wasp Hunter's Apprentice
column2: The Sapphire Queen^Mischief in the Making^Capture 12 Chicken Escapees for Elder Harkek.^Dumb Goregek stumble into chicken house and let all the chickens go! They all around hill - go get chickens back! <Elder Harkek shoos you away.>

column1: The Wasp Hunter's Apprentice^77^All^Sholazar Basin^High-Shaman Rakjak^High-Shaman Rakjak^^The Ape Hunter's Slave
column2: Tormenting the Softknuckles^Flown the Coop!^Kill 6 Sapphire Hive Wasps and 9 Sapphire Hive Drones for High-Shaman Rakjak in Frenzyheart Hill.^Rakjak not dumb. Maybe you good at killing things. Maybe Frenzyheart can make you into real hunter. Dajik hunts giant wasp things better than all wolvar. Go with Dajik to Sapphire Hive to southeast or to river in south and learn the hunt.

column1: The Sapphire Queen^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Elder Harkek^High-Shaman Rakjak^^The Ape Hunter's Slave
column2: Tormenting the Softknuckles^Flown the Coop!^Bring the Stinger of the Sapphire Queen to High-Shaman Rakjak at Frenzyheart Hill.^Bristlepine can be dangerous
column3: but most stay far away from wolvar. Wasps on other hand not fear the Frenzyheart... they even kill some of our hunters. I know Rakjak want wasp queen dead
column4: but no wolvar want to go into her hive. You go kill wasp queen in Sapphire Hive to southeast and get stinger for Rakjak. Me bet Rakjak like that.

column1: Mischief in the Making^77^All^Sholazar Basin^High-Shaman Rakjak^High-Shaman Rakjak^^Flown the Coop!^A Rough Ride^High-Shaman Rakjak at Frenzyheart Hill wants 8 Skyreach Crystal Clusters.^You good hunter
column2: but Frenzyheart can make you stronger. Harkek think maybe you ready for something more important. Before Rakjak send you on important mission
column3: you need gather things for Rakjak. All along river to south are blue crystals. Rakjak need lots of blue crystals. You go get crystals now.

column1: A Rough Ride^77^All^Sholazar Basin^High-Shaman Rakjak^Zepik the Gorloc Hunter^^The Underground Menace
column2: Mischief in the Making^Lightning Definitely Strikes Twice
column3: The Mist Isn't Listening^Ride the captive crocolisk to Mistwhisper Refuge and then speak to Zepik for further instructions.^Zepik is best hunter of the Frenzyheart. Zepik hunts big-tongues... ugly things near swamps that try to steal all stuff they can find. Zepik going on long trek to break big-tongue shrine and try to scare them away. We no want big-tongues in this land anymore. There a crocolisk chained on northeast side of hill
column4: next to tree - go with Zepik and do what Zepik tell you.

column1: Lightning Definitely Strikes Twice^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Zepik the Gorloc Hunter^Zepik the Gorloc Hunter^^A Rough Ride^Hoofing It^Zepik wants you to smash the Skyreach Crystal Clusters in front of the Mistwhisper weather shrine.^Okay
column2: the crystal things... The big-tongues use the crystals to power their rain shrines. Zepik not know quite how it works
column3: but Zepik does know that if they use wrong crystals
column4: the clouds and the rain go crazy! Zepik tried to sneak in at one of their other rain shrines
column5: but it not go so well. It sure to go much better with two! Take crystals
column6: place at big stone pillar shrine thing
column7: then smash them to release power. Zepik not sure what will happen
column8: so might want to step back after.

column1: The Mist Isn't Listening^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Zepik the Gorloc Hunter^Zepik the Gorloc Hunter^^A Rough Ride^Hoofing It^Zepik wants you to kill 12 Mistwhisper Gorlocs.^Gorillas and wasps are boring! Big-tongues the only thing fun to hunt. While we mess up rain shrine
column2: we kill lots of mist big-tongues. That sure to make them not want to come back to village thing. <Zepik nods to himself confidently.>

column1: Hoofing It^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Zepik the Gorloc Hunter^High-Shaman Rakjak^Hoofing It^Lightning Definitely Strikes Twice
column2: The Mist Isn't Listening^^Find your way back to Frenzyheart Hill and speak to High-Shaman Rakjak.^Okay
column3: we done! Time to go back. No crocolisk to ride this time though. If we go east and stay near ridge
column4: it should lead all the way back near hill. Need to be careful not to go far below ridge though or we might go right into big-tongue tree village thing. Zepik not think they like us right now.

column1: Just Following Orders^77^All^Sholazar Basin^High-Shaman Rakjak^Injured Rainspeaker Oracle^Hoofing It^^Fortunate Misunderstandings^Locate an Injured Rainspeaker Oracle for High-Shaman Rakjak at Frenzyheart Hill.^Okay <guy/lady>
column2: Rakjak have very important job. You go capture injured big-tongue that tracker spotted at river to north. Not bring hunter this time because they maybe want to just kill it. I want to hide it so that I can poke it and make it tell me things. Go you and bring me big-tongue prize thing.

column1: Troll Patrol: The Alchemist's Apprentice^76^All^Zul'Drak^Alchemist Finklestein^Alchemist Finklestein^^^^Alchemist Finklestein at Heb'Valok wants you to assist him in the creation of a truth serum.^Ahh
column2: you must be the promised patrol. Your timing couldn't be better. I have urgent need of an extra pair of hands. We have a Drakkari prisoner who's been sent here to undergo questioning. Before the interrogation begins
column3: I require assistance in the creation of a truth serum. Creating a truth serum is tricky business
column4: demanding keen instincts
column5: perfect timing
column6: and improvisation at every step. Let me know when you're ready
column7: <race>. And remember
column8: timing is everything!

column1: The Call Of The Crusade^74^All^Dragonblight^Tilda Darathan^Crusader Valus^The Call Of The Crusade^^^Report to Crusader Valus at Light's Trust in Dragonblight.^<class>! The Argent Crusade is looking for able bodied soldiers that are willing to set aside their differences and join forces to battle the forces of the Lich King. Will you take up our cause? Should you be interested
column2: venture north to Light's Trust and speak with Crusader Valus. You will find Light's Trust amidst the ruins of the sacked troll city of Jintha'kalar - bordering Zul'Drak. Farewell.

column1: An Offering for Soo-rahm^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Oracle Soo-rahm^Oracle Soo-rahm^Rhino Mastery: The Test^^^Bring 5 Intact Cobra Fangs to Oracle Soo-rahm
column2: near the Bones of Nozronn.^We not know you
column3: stranger
column4: but we know you want something. We will talk to Bones of Nozronn for you
column5: but you must bring us offerings. We need powerful emperor cobra fangs to complete our oracle's necklace. Go to the Wildgrowth Mangal
column6: northeast of our hut
column7: find cobras and bring back best fangs. Then we make bones speak to you.

column1: The Bones of Nozronn^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Oracle Soo-rahm^Hemet Nesingwary^Rhino Mastery: The Test^^Rhino Mastery: The Kill^Use Soo-rahm's Incense near the Bones of Nozronn
column2: then return to Hemet Nesingwary at Nesingwary's Base Camp with the information you learned.^Bones of Nozronn
column3: Oracle Soo-rahm sends <name> to you! We have prepared incense for you. Light it and place it near Nozronn's head and you will hear his voice. <Confused
column4: you tell Soo-rahm that you haven't even told him your question.> True
column5: we not know
column6: but mighty Nozronn does. Do not doubt. Nozronn will answer your heart's question. Go. Nozronn not wait long.

column1: The Cleansing Of Jintha'kalar^74^All^Dragonblight^Crusader Valus^Crusader Valus^The Call Of The Crusade^^Into the Breach!^Crusader Valus at Light's Trust in Dragonblight has asked you to slay 15 Jintha'kalar Scourge.^We wrested this ancient Drakkari temple from a swarm of invading Scourge. Not more than one-hundred paces from where we stand is the ruined city of Jintha'kalar. Scourge necromancers run amok
column2: turning the living Drakkari trolls that remain into servants of the Lich King. All are now lost to the Light. All must be purged. <Valus looks upon you sternly.> All.

column1: Reclamation^78^All^Sholazar Basin^Avatar of Freya^Avatar of Freya^The Lifewarden's Wrath^^^Go to the Avalanche in Sholazar Basin and use the Omega Rune to deploy Etymidian. Use him to slay 200 Scourge Minions
column2: Bythius the Flesh-Shaper
column3: Urgreth of the Thousand Tombs and Hailscorn.^It is time
column4: <name>. The Etymidian is one of the most destructive forces ever created by the titans and I am loathe to unleash him in my lands. There is little choice
column5: however. Our enemies have forced my hand and the fury of the titans will cleanse all.

column1: The Activation Rune^78^All^Un'Goro Crater^The Etymidian^The Etymidian^The Lifewarden's Wrath^^^Obtain the Omega Rune inside the Shaper's Terrace and bring it to The Etymidian.^This colossal being appears to be inactive. You notice an empty rune-shaped slot on its chest. Perhaps you might be able to find the missing rune inside the nearby overlook.

The Etymidian^78^All^Sholazar Basin^Avatar of Freya^The Etymidian^The Lifewarden's Wrath^^^Go through the Waygate in the southern end of Sholazar Basin and look for the weapon known as the Etymidian on the other side.^It is time
column2: <name>. The Waygate has been activated for the first time in seven centuries. Use it to travel to where our final hope lies. Let us put an end to those who would seek to bring the taint of undeath to this pristine land. Let us unleash the Etymidian.

column1: Dreadsaber Mastery: Becoming a Predator^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Buck Cantwell^Buck Cantwell^Dreadsaber Mastery: Becoming a Predator^Wipe That Grin Off His Face^Crocolisk Mastery: The Trial^Kill 15 Dreadsabers and return to Buck Cantwell at the Nesingwary Base Camp.^If you've hunted with Hemet before
column2: you know that he's tested his skill against many large cats
column3: but the dreadsabers here in Sholazar are different. They're able to bring down larger game than I've ever seen a cat hunt. To overcome and kill such a predator is the mark of a true hunter. If you seek to prove you're up to the challenge
column4: test yourself against the dreadsabers. They live in the wilderness surrounding the camp and south of the river.

column1: Dreadsaber Mastery: Stalking the Prey^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Buck Cantwell^Buck Cantwell^Dreadsaber Mastery: Becoming a Predator^^^Buck Cantwell at the Nesingwary Base Camp wants you to identify 3 Shango Tracks from the Dreadsaber Tracks near Bittertide Lake.^I have heard that the natives tell stories of a large dreadsaber they call Shango. I haven't seen any evidence of this Shango's existence
column2: but my injuries have kept me from venturing outside the camp. If you fancy yourself something of a tracker
column3: you might be able to find out the truth about Shango. Debaar said she saw some large tracks on her last outing. Go north from the camp toward Bittertide Lake
column4: and search its southern shore for the prints.

column1: Crocolisk Mastery: The Trial^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Debaar^Debaar^Crocolisk Mastery: The Trial^Rhino Mastery: The Test^^Kill 15 Mangal Crocolisks and return to Debaar at the Nesingwary Encampment.^I warn you
column2: stranger -- do not make any comments about crashing the ship. I already get enough of it from the rest of the expedition. If you're looking to try your hand at hunting
column3: though
column4: you should test your skills against the wily mangal crocolisks. They live all along the river to the south
column5: and in the Wildgrowth Mangal to the east. Prove you can hold your own against them and we'll talk again
column6: hunter.

column1: Death to the Necromagi^76^All^Zul'Drak^Sergeant Moonshard^Sergeant Moonshard^Death to the Necromagi^Pa'Troll^^Sergeant Moonshard at Drak'Sotra has asked you to destroy 8 Hath'ar Necromagi.^When the trolls brought down Kolramas
column2: it crashed next to us to the southeast. Unfortunately the crash did not destroy all of the Scourge within. Now they're raising our men from the dead and using them against us! This will not be allowed to continue. You will see to it that their necromagi are slaughtered! Do we understand each other?

column1: Skimmer Spinnerets^76^All^Zul'Drak^Specialist Cogwheel^Specialist Cogwheel^Skimmer Spinnerets^^A Tangled Skein^Specialist Cogwheel at Drak'Sotra has asked you to collect 5 Intact Skimmer Spinnerets.^Why do I always get the tough tasks to tackle? The Scourge at Kolramas have plague sprayers that are getting dangerously close. You don't want to know what's going to happen if they start heading this way! I've got an idea for how we might bring them down
column2: but first we're going to need something... something from their own creatures. The Hath'ar skimmers can spin a very strong web that we can put to good use. Bring back some of their spinnerets.

column1: Malas the Corrupter^76^All^Zul'Drak^Sergeant Moonshard^Sergeant Moonshard^Death to the Necromagi^^^Sergeant Moonshard at Drak'Sotra insists that you return with the Head of the Corrupter.^<name>
column2: gather at least one other person and head back down there! You'll find the leader of Kolramas
column3: Malas the Corrupter
column4: gloating from atop the crashed necropolis. Kill him and bring me his head!

column1: A Tangled Skein^76^All^Zul'Drak^Specialist Cogwheel^Specialist Cogwheel^Skimmer Spinnerets^Skimmer Spinnerets
column2: Crashed Sprayer
column3: Throwing Down^^Specialist Cogwheel at Drak'Sotra has asked you to use the Tangled Skein Thrower in order to cause the destruction of 5 Plague Sprayers.^There! One tangled skein thrower ready and waiting for you to take those plague sprayers down. You just aim and let loose. The webbing should foul up their hover spells long enough to cause them to crash to the ground just like Kolramas. Kind of poetic. I like that!

column1: Rhino Mastery: The Kill^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Hemet Nesingwary^Hemet Nesingwary^^The Bones of Nozronn^In Search of Bigger Game^Bring Farunn's Horn to Hemet Nesingwary at the Nesingwary Base Camp.^Now that we know where to find Farunn
column2: all that remains is the battle against the great beast. Are you ready to take on this rhino
column3: <name>? For all the spirit's blustering
column4: I'm certain it was telling the truth about the beast's strength. When you're ready to face him
column5: head north past the Suntouched Pillar and look for Farunn on the northeast shore of the Bittertide Lake. It may even venture near the Glimmering Pillar. Bring back its horn to commemorate your kill.

column1: Lab Work^76^All^Zul'Drak^Alchemist Finklestein^Alchemist Finklestein^^^^Alchemist Finklestein at Heb'Valok wants you to find a Muddy Mire Maggot
column2: a Withered Batwing
column3: an Amberseed
column4: and some Chilled Serpent Mucus from within his laboratory.^I assume by your interruption that you wish to be numbered among those I am considering for apprenticeship. A worthy aspiration... Should I someday choose to accept your petition
column5: I must be confident that you can find your way around my laboratory. I have many ingredients here; some plentiful
column6: and others in short supply. Take your time
column7: <class>. Find a muddy mire maggot
column8: a withered batwing
column9: an amberseed
column10: and some chilled serpent mucus. Succeed
column11: and I'll know to take your request seriously.

column1: Dreadsaber Mastery: Ready to Pounce^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Buck Cantwell^Buck Cantwell^Dreadsaber Mastery: Becoming a Predator^^^Bring Shango's Pelt to Buck Cantwell at the Nesingwary Base Camp.^Shango awaits
column2: <name>. If you have succeeded in your tracking
column3: he will not know that you stalk him
column4: and you will need the advantage. He is supposed to be bigger
column5: stronger
column6: and more ferocious than the other dreadsabers of the basin. Travel north
column7: to the western shore of Bittertide Lake and near the falls that feed it
column8: do battle with Shango. If you succeed
column9: return with his pelt.

column1: Powering the Waygate - The Maker's Perch^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Avatar of Freya^Avatar of Freya^The Lifewarden's Wrath^^^The Avatar of Freya at the Rainspeaker Rapids wants you to go to the Maker's Perch and use the Activation Switch Gamma.^It is time then. Let us activate the waygate. You will find the first switch inside the Maker's Perch in the western edge of the basin. Beware
column2: <name>. The titans used the perch to watch over their creations. Many of their stone servants still guard the place.

column1: Crocolisk Mastery: The Plan^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Debaar^Debaar^Crocolisk Mastery: The Trial^^^Bring 5 Sandfern fronds to Debaar at the Nesingwary Base Camp.^The mangal crocolisk is a master of the ambush
column2: and I intend to beat the best at his game. To do that
column3: we'll need to construct a convincing camouflage for you. We'll use plants that grow in the sandy soil of the riverbanks and lake beaches. The sandfern is best for this purpose. It grows in the sandy areas near the shores of the Seabreach Flow
column4: just to the south
column5: Bittertide Lake and Bittertide Falls
column6: to the north
column7: and the edges of River's Heart
column8: the large lake beyond the mangal to the east.

column1: An Issue of Trust^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Avatar of Freya^Avatar of Freya^Force of Nature^^^Obtain Freya's trust by destroying 6 Blighted Corpses and 10 Bonescythe Ravagers in the Lost Lands.^This should never have happened. The forces of undeath storm the very cradle of life! If you're not here to destroy the minions of the Lich King
column2: then leave at once. Do not incur my wrath by distracting me from my duties.

column1: The Drakkari Do Not Need Water Elementals!^76^All^Zul'Drak^Sub-Lieutenant Jax^Sub-Lieutenant Jax^^^^Sub-Lieutenant Jax at The Argent Stand has asked you to kill 10 Drakkari Water Binders.^Intelligence reports that ever since those water elementals appeared in the Drak'Sotra Fields
column2: a number of Drakkari shaman have come down from the upper tiers of Zul'Drak to take control of them. I cannot stress enough
column3: <sir /ma'am>
column4: how dangerous that could prove. We do not want them to have water elementals at their disposal. The commander has ordered that these Drakkari water binders are to be put to the sword. Head south when you're ready.

column1: Troll Patrol^76^All^Zul'Drak^Commander Kunz^Commander Kunz^^Pa'Troll^^Commander Kunz at the Argent Stand wants you to visit the four Argent Crusade posts
column2: follow their captain's orders
column3: and then return and report to him.^Unsheathe that weapon
column4: <race>. It's time to go on patrol! I've got four posts under my command and it's crucial to our success that they remain in our control. I'm ordering you to visit each of them and offer your assistance. You can begin with Captain Brandon southeast of here. He'll direct you to the next post when he's finished with you. Report back to me once you've assisted each of my men. And remember
column5: you'll be more richly rewarded for returning to me quickly - so double-time it! Dismissed!

column1: Troll Patrol: Something for the Pain^76^All^Zul'Drak^Captain Brandon^Captain Brandon^^^^Captain Brandon at Drak'Sotra wants you to collect 5 Mature Water-Poppies from Drak'Sotra Fields.^Gritty as my men are
column2: they're still mortal. Wounds and pain diminish their ability to perform their missions. No amount of training changes that simple fact of life. Thankfully
column3: one of our alchemists has developed a recipe for a salve that binds to our bandages and greatly reduces the pain our soldiers experience. The salve requires a special poppy these trolls cultivate just west of here. Go to Drak'Sotra Fields and harvest some of them to keep our stockpiles from running out.

column1: The Blessing of Zim'Abwa^76^All^Zul'Drak^Hexxer Ubungo^Zim'Abwa^^^Blessing of Zim'Abwa^Hexxer Ubungo at The Argent Stand wants you to present 10 Drakkari Offerings to the statue of Zim'Abwa.^I am heartened to see the zeal with which your Argent Crusade is dealing with the Scourge
column2: <race>. I would like to help with your efforts. The Drakkari trolls of this once-great city used to make regular offerings to their gods
column3: but now neglect them
column4: or worse. If you were to make offerings to the gods
column5: they would show their appreciation in return. Zim'Abwa's statue is just to the southwest. Zim'Abwa would gladly accept your offerings of Drakkari artifacts as a sign that you are protecting Zul'Drak.

column1: Help for Camp Winterhoof^71^Horde^Howling Fjord^Longrunner Nanik^Chieftain Ashtotem^^^^Speak with Chieftain Ashtotem at Camp Winterhoof.^I am Longrunner Nanik of the Taunka
column2: sent by the chieftain of Camp Winterhoof to seek out allies in the fight against the vrykul. They mass to the west and south of our village
column3: and though we slay 10 of them for every one of our dead
column4: we cannot hold. Apothecary Scyllis has promised to send brave <class>s northwest to our aid. Will you help my people fend off the vrykul assaults? Follow the road far to the northwest
column5: across the river
column6: and into the foothills of the mountains to reach Camp Winterhoof.

column1: Troll Patrol: Done to Death^76^All^Zul'Drak^Captain Rupert^Captain Rupert^^^^Captain Rupert wants you to use the Incinerating Oil on 5 Defeated Argent Footmen in Drak'Sotra.^Trust me
column2: <race>. I know.... The smell of burnt flesh has become sickening to even me
column3: a Forsaken. Nevertheless
column4: it is our solemn duty to ensure that our brethren never walk with the Scourge. Pour this oil on the corpses of our fallen to ensure that we never face them on the battlefield as enemies.

column1: Crocolisk Mastery: The Ambush^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Debaar^Debaar^Crocolisk Mastery: The Trial^^^Bring Bushwhacker's Jaw to Debaar at the Nesingwary Base Camp.^The largest crocolisk in the basin
column2: known around here as "Bushwhacker" for his ambush prowess
column3: likes to sun himself in the shallow waters of River's Heart. It's the large lake at the basin's center
column4: and is to the east of our camp. I want you to take the camouflage I've prepared and hide on the western beach of River's Heart and ambush Bushwhacker when he shows himself. Bring back his mighty jaws if you are able to overcome him.

column1: Fortunate Misunderstandings^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Injured Rainspeaker Oracle^High-Oracle Soo-say^Fortunate Misunderstandings^Just Following Orders^Gods like Shiny Things^Escort the Injured Rainspeaker Oracle to Rainspaker Canopy and speak to High-Oracle Soo-say.^I sorry! I not mean to get you in trouble! <The injured oracle stares at you blankly for a long while.> You save me! We thank you. We going to go back to village now. You come too... you can stay with us! Puppy-men kind of mean anyway. Let me know when you ready to go
column2: okay?

column1: Make the Bad Snake Go Away^77^All^Sholazar Basin^High-Oracle Soo-say^High-Oracle Soo-say^Fortunate Misunderstandings^^Making Peace^High-Oracle Soo-say in Rainspeaker Canopy wants you to kill Venomtip and 10 Emperor Cobras.^We were here long before the puppy-men came. This is very sacred place - we will not leave. You seem like maybe you good
column2: but we have Lafoo stay with you just in case. You understand we think. There snakes thing that keeps trying to eat our hatchlings. Go with Lafoo and make them stop
column3: okay? Especially big one near waterfall to northeast.

column1: Gods like Shiny Things^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Lafoo^High-Oracle Soo-say^^Fortunate Misunderstandings^Making Peace^Collect 6 of the treasures that Lafoo digs up and bring them to High-Oracle Soo-say in Rainspeaker Canopy.^Soo-say said we go with you. You be nice
column2: okay? Ooh
column3: ooh! We know! We can make Soo-say happy if we bring back more offerings for shrine! We not need to go far
column4: there's always stuffs to dig up around village... just look for sparkles in dirt! Let's go! Let's go! More offerings for shrine!

column1: Making Peace^77^All^Sholazar Basin^High-Oracle Soo-say^High-Oracle Soo-say^Fortunate Misunderstandings^Make the Bad Snake Go Away
column2: Gods like Shiny Things^Back So Soon?^High-Oracle Soo-say at Rainspeaker Canopy wants you to give a peace offering to Shaman Vekjik and then return with his response.^We have great idea. You were friends with puppy-men
column3: they maybe listen to you. We want you to go give offering to Shaman Vekjik. He southwest where river turns into waterfall. Tell puppy-man we no want fight. Tell him we play nice. You good <race>. We trust you do this right.

column1: Back So Soon?^77^All^Sholazar Basin^High-Oracle Soo-say^Mistcaller Soo-gan^^Making Peace^The Lost Mistwhisper Treasure
column2: Forced Hand^Travel to Mistwhisper Refuge and speak to Mistcaller Soo-gan.^<High-Oracle Soo-say stares at your forehead for a while before speaking.> Soo-gan ask for help. We think they might have been attacked by puppy-men again. We sending you and Jaloot to help... follow west river up to Mistwhisper Refuge. Do what Soo-gan says... hit the puppy-men on the nose if they being mean
column3: they don't like that. <High-Oracle Soo-say goes back to staring at your forehead as you leave.>

column1: The Lost Mistwhisper Treasure^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Mistcaller Soo-gan^Mistcaller Soo-gan^^Back So Soon?^Home Time!^Kill Warlord Tartek and retrieve the Mistwhisper Treasure for Mistcaller Soo-gan at Mistwhisper Refuge.^So some puppy-men come and smash blue crystals at Great Mist Stone! Lots of rain and lightning and badness... blue is wrong crystal for Great Mist Stone! Dumb puppy-men. After lightning
column2: puppy-men stole big treasure we found in the sea-lake. We need treasure back to give to Great Mist Stone! Mist Stone is angry after what the puppy-men did! One who took it named Tarter... no
column3: Tiktak... no
column4: no... Tartek. That it
column5: Tartek! He went to the camp thing to north. Go get treasure back!

column1: Forced Hand^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Mistcaller Soo-gan^Mistcaller Soo-gan^^Back So Soon?^Home Time!^Kill 8 Frenzyheart Spearbearers and 6 Frenzyheart Scavengers for Mistcaller Soo-gan at Mistwhisper Refuge.^We try to be nice to puppy-men ever since they came
column2: but they nothing but mean. We okay with them being dumb - they not do much harm. Now they mess with sacred shrines though. Sacred shrines not for messing with. The Great Stones are here from all the way back when the Great Ones made us. We wouldn't know what to do if the Great Mist Stone were hurt. Go to their camp to north... make puppy-men stop and not come back!

column1: Home Time!^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Mistcaller Soo-gan^High-Oracle Soo-say^Home Time!^The Lost Mistwhisper Treasure
column2: Forced Hand^^Return to Rainspeaker Canopy.^You're a good dryskin. Mistwhisper safe
column3: treasure safe
column4: and puppy-men sure to leave us alone now. You go back to Rainspeaker Canopy and tell Soo-say you done good.

column1: The Angry Gorloc^77^All^Sholazar Basin^High-Oracle Soo-say^Moodle^Home Time!^^Lifeblood of the Mosswalker Shrine
column2: The Mosswalker Savior^Travel to Mosswalker Village and speak to Moodle once you've arrived.^I not think you be back in time to go out again
column3: but I wrong. I sending Moodle to nearby Mosswalker friends to bop silly Mosswalkers for not coming see shrine. Their village is east
column4: up ridge
column5: northeast of broken pillar. You go with Moodle! He extra smart Rainspeaker... you listen to him good-like.

column1: Lifeblood of the Mosswalker Shrine^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Moodle^Moodle^^The Angry Gorloc^^Moodle wants you to collect 10 Lifeblood Shards
column2: but stay away from the cave inside of the pillar itself.^I've always suspected that the pillars have been the main reason for our weather and seclusion from the undead... this confirms it a bit. Not terribly long ago
column3: there was a sound of a great explosion when the Lifeblood Pillar fell. The weather changed for the mosswalkers almost immediately... it began to snow
column4: something we never see. They were able to stop the snow by bringing more lifeblood crystals to the Great Moss Stone. Perhaps if we can do the same
column5: it will help ward off the undead as well.

column1: The Mosswalker Savior^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Moodle^Moodle^^The Angry Gorloc^A Hero's Burden^Moodle wants you to rescue 6 of the Mosswalker Victims in Mosswalker Village
column2: though some of them may no longer be alive to save.^There's some small chance that the Mosswalkers are not all dead yet... and at the very least
column3: they deserve to not be butchered like this. Let's find some revenge for this slaughter and see if there are any to be saved in the process.

column1: A Hero's Burden^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Moodle^Artruis's Phylactery^^The Mosswalker Savior^Frenzyheart Champion
column2: Hand of the Oracles^Kill Artruis the Heartless.^Perhaps the crystals will ward off the undead gradually
column3: but there is one more thing that must be done. We need to find the leader of these undead and kill him to ensure there's no one to push the wretches back upon us. If my suspicions are correct
column4: he will be somewhere inside the fallen pillar... the Sundered Shard. The corpses being dragged there would suggest as much anyway. I'll place the shards and bring the news to Soo-say... you will need to find other help in the meantime.

column1: Crashed Sprayer^76^All^Zul'Drak^Specialist Cogwheel^Specialist Cogwheel^Crashed Sprayer^^A Tangled Skein^Specialist Cogwheel at Drak'Sotra has asked you to collect Plague Sprayer Parts.^I know that one of those plague sprayers crashed somewhere within Drak'Sotra to the west of us. Why don't you see if you can find it. I can use the parts from the sprayer to create the device that's going to bring those things down!
Pure Evil^76^All^Zul'Drak^Captain Rupert^Eitrigg^^^^Captain Rupert has asked you to collect 10 Chunks of Saronite and deliver them to Eitrigg at The Argent Stand.^We know that Kolramas
column2: the crashed necropolis to the southeast
column3: was carrying a large amount of an ore known as saronite when the trolls shot it down. My scouts tell me that much of the saronite is strewn about within the innards of that thing. Eitrigg and his friends back at The Argent Stand want a bunch of the stuff so that they can study it. I want you to head in there and see if you can collect enough for them.

column1: Troll Patrol: Creature Comforts^76^All^Zul'Drak^Captain Grondel^Captain Grondel^^^^Captain Grondel at Drak'Agal wants you to bring him 20 pieces of Dead Thornwood.^Well
column2: it ain't glamorous
column3: but it needs doin'. My troops have been fightin' their hearts out while knee-deep in stagnant water for days on end. That just can't be good fer ya. What they need is a nice fire to dry 'em out and lighten their spirits. This part of the city's soaked
column4: but the dead roots of these thornwood trees have a way of resistin' the moisture. Round us up some fuel for burnin' and we'll be mighty grateful.

column1: Troll Patrol^76^All^Zul'Drak^Commander Kunz^Commander Kunz^^Pa'Troll^^Commander Kunz at the Argent Stand wants you to visit the four Argent Crusade posts
column2: follow their captain's orders
column3: and then return and report to him.^Unsheathe that weapon
column4: <race>. It's time to go on patrol! I've got four posts under my command and it's crucial to our success that they remain in our control. I'm ordering you to visit each of them and offer your assistance. You can begin with Captain Brandon southeast of here. He'll direct you to the next post when he's finished with you. Report back to me once you've assisted each of my men. And remember
column5: you'll be more richly rewarded for returning to me quickly - so double-time it! Dismissed!

column1: Troll Patrol: Can You Dig It?^76^All^Zul'Drak^Captain Brandon^Captain Brandon^^^^Captain Brandon in Drak'Sotra wants you to use the Steel Spade on the nearby Ancient Dirt Mounds to recover the Ancient Drakkari Relic.^One of our troops came across an old treasure map during our last offensive. If what it shows is true
column2: then there are priceless troll artifacts nearby. My soldiers have their hands full
column3: pressed between the Drakkari and the Scourge. I need you to follow up on this intelligence. Take this shovel and use it at the loose dirt mounds to the southwest. Return to me after a diligent search has been conducted.

column1: Kick
column2: What Kick?^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Drostan^Drostan^Kick
column3: What Kick?^Wipe That Grin Off His Face^^Using the RJR Rifle
column4: shoot the apple on top of Lucky Wilhelm's head
column5: then speak with Drostan.^So you think you can shoot? Well
column6: let's give it a try. Here
column7: we'll start you out with something nice and gentle. Don't worry
column8: it's got no kick to it at all. Remember
column9: don't point that gun at anything you don't intend to fire at. Now
column10: when you're ready
column11: just take aim at that apple on top o' old Lucky Wilhelm's head and let 'er fly!

column1: Troll Patrol: Throwing Down^76^All^Zul'Drak^Captain Rupert^Captain Rupert^^^^Captain Rupert at Drak'Sotra wants you to use High Impact Grenades near 5 Nethurbian Craters.^Clever... Just when it seemed we were getting things under control
column2: they tunneled right underneath us and secured the shrine! Now we're caught between two nethurbian armies and our predicament is worsening by the minute. As our first course of action
column3: we must stop them from reinforcing. Their tunnels must be sealed. Take these grenades and throw them down their craters to the northwest.

column1: The Great Hunter's Challenge^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Drostan^Drostan^Kick
column2: What Kick?^^Lakeside Landing^Kill 60 Game Animals while you aid Hemet and his companions in their hunting. When you've killed your 60
column3: return to Drostan at the Nesingwary Base Camp to compare numbers.^So y'have something of a hunter's instinct. You're not a bad shot
column4: and Hemet hasn't driven you out
column5: so he must be planning on including you in the hunt. How'd you like to have a bit of a competition
column6: just me and you? Hemet and the others will ask you to help in their hunting. Along the way
column7: you and I will count up the kills we contribute to their goals. Now
column8: this isn't something you can win in the blink of an eye
column9: and you'll find yourself killing many different kinds of creatures. Good luck!

column1: In Service Of The Lich King^55^All^Death Knight^The Lich King^Instructor Razuvious^In Service Of The Lich King^^^Report to Instructor Razuvious in the Heart of Acherus.^All that I am: anger
column2: cruelty
column3: vengeance - I bestow upon you
column4: my chosen knight. I have granted you immortality so that you may herald in a new
column5: dark age for the Scourge. Gaze now upon the lands below us. The Scarlet Crusade scurries to undo my work
column6: while Light's Hope stands defiantly against us - a blemish upon these Plaguelands. They must all be shown the price of their defiance. You will become my force of retribution. Where you tread
column7: doom will follow. Go now and claim your destiny
column8: death knight.

column1: Troll Patrol: Couldn't Care Less^76^All^Zul'Drak^Captain Grondel^Captain Grondel^^^^Captain Grondel wants you to kill 7 Mossy Rampagers in Drak'Agal.^Of all the posts
column2: they throw me in this one. The place is flooded with putrid
column3: stagnant water and now it's host to sewage elementals! I don't really know what they are or why they're here
column4: and frankly I couldn't care less. What I do know is they're making a mess of my sector! How am I supposed to conduct any dignified military operations with those foul things roaming around? Get out there
column5: <class>
column6: and don't come back 'til you've cleared your share of 'em off of my battlefield!

column1: In Search of Bigger Game^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Hemet Nesingwary^Dorian Drakestalker^^Rhino Mastery: The Kill^Sharpening Your Talons
column2: Securing the Bait^Speak with Dorian Drakestalker at Dorian's Outpost in Sholazar Basin.^Well
column3: <name>
column4: you've certainly proven your mettle as a hunter of all kinds of game animals -- rhinos
column5: cats
column6: and crocolisks. For some members of the expedition
column7: these creatures are sufficient to test their hunting skills
column8: but others
column9: like myself
column10: crave larger challenges. Dorian Drakestalker went north
column11: across Bittertide Lake and established a camp there. He's heard rumors of gigantic primordial drakes. Just imagine what a quarry they would be! Go check up on Dorian and see if he's had any luck.

column1: Pa'Troll^76^All^Zul'Drak^Commander Kunz^Commander Kunz^Taking a Stand^Defend the Stand
column2: Parachutes for the Argent Crusade^Troll Patrol
column3: Death to the Necromagi
column4: Troll Patrol
column5: Troll Patrol^Commander Kunz at The Argent Stand wants you to visit the four Argent Crusade posts
column6: follow their leaders' orders
column7: and then return and report to him.^Welcome to The Argent Stand
column8: scrub. I am Commander Kunz
column9: but you - you can call me... Commander. Don't think you're going to just cruise through my region
column10: picking which missions you're going to participate in
column11: answering to no one. Here
column12: you report to me and you follow my orders to the letter. Understood?! First
column13: you're going to get familiar with my men and the region we're charged with clearing. Report to each of them and do as they ask. Return to me when your patrol is done.

column1: Something for the Pain^76^All^Zul'Drak^Captain Brandon^Captain Brandon^^^^Captain Brandon at Drak'Sotra wants you to collect 5 Mature Water-Poppies from Drak'Sotra Fields.^Gritty as my men are
column2: they're still mortal. Wounds and pain diminish their ability to perform their missions. No amount of training changes that simple fact of life. Thankfully
column3: one of our alchemists has developed a recipe for a salve that binds to our bandages and greatly reduces the pain our soldiers experience. The salve requires a special poppy these trolls cultivate just west of here. Go to Drak'Sotra Fields and harvest some of them to keep our stockpiles from running out.

column1: Throwing Down^76^All^Zul'Drak^Captain Rupert^Captain Rupert^Throwing Down^^A Tangled Skein^Captain Rupert at Drak'Sotra wants you to use High Impact Grenades near 5 Nerubian Craters.^Clever... Just when it seemed we were getting things under control
column2: they tunneled right underneath us and secured the shrine! Now we're caught between two Nerubian armies and our predicament is worsening by the minute. As our first course of action
column3: we must stop them from reinforcing. Their tunnels must be sealed. Take these grenades and throw them down their craters to the northwest.

column1: Creature Comforts^76^All^Zul'Drak^Captain Grondel^Captain Grondel^^^^Captain Grondel at Drak'Agal wants you to bring him 20 pieces of Dead Thornwood.^Well
column2: it ain't glamorous
column3: but it needs doin'. My troops have been fightin' their hearts out while knee-deep in stagnant water for days on end. That just can't be good fer ya. What they need is a nice fire to dry 'em out and lighten their spirits. This part of the city's soaked
column4: but the dead roots of these thornwood trees have a way of resistin' the moisture. Round us up some fuel for burnin' and we'll be mighty grateful.

column1: Sharpening Your Talons^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Dorian Drakestalker^Dorian Drakestalker^^In Search of Bigger Game^A Mammoth Undertaking
column2: My Pet Roc
column3: Reagent Agent
column4: Burning to Help^Kill 6 Primordial Drakes and then speak with Dorian Drakestalker at Dorian's Outpost.^The primordial drakes occupy most of the area to the north and east
column5: and I can feel the heat of their breath even at this distance. Before we can challenge the mightiest among the drakes
column6: we must test our skills against the lesser creatures. Still
column7: don't let your guard down; any one of these beasts can devour a man whole. Once you've familiarized yourself with the combat tactics of these drakes
column8: return and I will tell you our next step.

column1: Securing the Bait^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Dorian Drakestalker^Dorian Drakestalker^^In Search of Bigger Game^^Bring 6 Primordial Hatchlings to Dorian Drakestalker at Dorian's Outpost.^We're not likely to get Broodmother Slivina's attention waving our arms around like fools
column2: but if we're smart
column3: we can bait her into fighting us. We'll also secure more
column4: uh
column5: fodder for my little project. <Dorian glances over at Zootfizzle.> But don't worry about that for now. Just look for the primordial drake eggs in the area east and northeast of the camp. Burst them open and scoop up the hatchlings that come out. When the broodmother realizes what we've done
column6: she'll have no choice but to face us.

column1: Cocooned!^76^All^Zul'Drak^Captain Rupert^Captain Rupert^^^^Captain Rupert wants you to open the Nerubian Cocoons in Drak'Sotra and return to him once you have freed 3 Captive Footmen.^Now that the tunnels have been sealed
column2: our next concern is recovering those who have fallen to the enemy. With any luck
column3: several of our soldiers are still alive and relatively well inside the nerubian cocoons. Free them
column4: <class>
column5: while you still can!

column1: A Mammoth Undertaking^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Zootfizzle^Zootfizzle^^Sharpening Your Talons^Post-partum Aggression^Bring a Shattertusk Mammoth to Zootfizzle at Dorian's Outpost.^Before you go off challenging Broodmother Slivina
column2: Dorian thought it might be a good idea for you and Hemet to coordinate your efforts by riding into battle on the back of a mammoth. The area around the camp is full of them. Just take this bridle and skip it over the head of a shattertusk mammoth. Be careful of the bulls
column3: though. They won't tolerate the harness at all. Bring the mammoth back here when you've found a suitable one.

column1: Cultist Incursion^78^All^Sholazar Basin^Cultist Corpse^Avatar of Freya^Force of Nature^^Exterminate the Intruders
column2: Weapons of Destruction^Speak to the Avatar of Freya at the Rainspeaker Rapids.^<It appears the Avatar of Freya was right. The undead were not able to enter Sholazar Basin before the Lifeblood Pillar was brought down -- they used their living agents from the Cult of the Damned instead.> <You'd best warn her about the Lich King's living agents within Sholazar Basin.>

column1: Stocking the Shelves^76^All^Zul'Drak^Captain Arnath^Captain Arnath^^Siphoning the Spirits^^Captain Arnath in Heb'Valok asked you to collect 7 units of Fresh Spider Ichor from the Trapdoor Crawlers in Zul'Drak.^Listen
column2: <class>. I realize that it's a lot to ask.... Fresh spider ichor is somewhat hard to come by
column3: even in these heavily infested regions. But Finklestein said he'd settle for no less than a vat of it
column4: and that he needs it soon. I'll keep my men out in the field collecting reagents
column5: but if the alchemist's order is going to be filled in time
column6: they'll require some assistance. As you roam the fields of Zul'Drak
column7: keep your eyes peeled for trapdoor crawlers and bring me all of the ichor you can find.

column1: Clipping Their Wings^76^All^Zul'Drak^Captain Arnath^Captain Arnath^^Siphoning the Spirits^^Captain Arnath in Heb'Valok has asked you to collect 7 Unblemished Bat Wings from Zul'Drak Bats.^Ever since Finklestein's arrival
column2: I've been relegated to collecting various ingredients for his experiments and recipes. I'll follow my orders as I've vowed to do
column3: but I'm a seasoned veteran. I've taken part in dozens of conflicts. I'd much rather be on the front lines
column4: having a more direct impact on the Crusade's outcome here. Help me
column5: <race>. Collect some bat wings for me so that I might get back to the real action sooner.

column1: Returned Sevenfold^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Avatar of Freya^Avatar of Freya^Force of Nature^^^The Avatar of Freya wants you defeat Thalgran Blightbringer by using Freya's Ward to reflect his Deathbolts back to him sevenfold.^The agents of the Lich King have foolishly trespassed upon these lands where the power of life rules supreme. All harm they inflict will be returned to them sevenfold. The monster directly responsible for corrupting the land is known as Thalgran Blightbringer; you will find him just to the north of here. Take this ward and use it to reflect the power of death upon him. Show the Scourge that the power of life prevails above all.

The Fallen Pillar^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Avatar of Freya^Cultist Corpse^Force of Nature^^Salvaging Life's Strength^Travel to the Lifeblood Pillar and look for clues to its destruction.^The titans shaped entire life forms here
column2: fostering their unfettered growth. The five crystal pillars that surround the basin emanate pure lifeforce. The Scourge should've never been able to penetrate the basin
column3: but one of the pillars was destroyed. Go to the Lifeblood Pillar and see if you can find out what happened. No undead would've been able to approach the pillar
column4: so keep your eyes out for living intruders. You'll find what remains of the pillar directly south of here.

column1: Powering the Waygate - The Maker's Overlook^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Avatar of Freya^Avatar of Freya^The Lifewarden's Wrath^^^The Avatar of Freya wants you to head to the Maker's Overlook in eastern Sholazar Basin and use the Activation Switch Theta.^We cannot stop now
column2: <race>. You've triggered the first switch
column3: but one remains. The titans constructed a second vantage point where they oversaw their creations. You'll find it to the east
column4: high in the mountains. Pull the activation switch theta inside the overlook and the waygate will open.

column1: Post-partum Aggression^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Dorian Drakestalker^Dorian Drakestalker^^A Mammoth Undertaking^^Kill Broodmother Slivina and return to Dorian Drakestalker at Dorian's Outpost.^Broodmother Slivina's likely to be a snarling ball of teeth
column2: spikes
column3: and talons. You've gone and stolen her children away and no mother takes kindly to that. 'Tis true they hatched from eggs
column4: but she loves the little beasts no less than your mother loves you. She'll be desperate and fierce in equal measures
column5: everything Hemet loves in a target. You and he
column6: along with that mammoth
column7: should be a match for her. She's on her perch at the northern edge of the Savage Thicket and hungers for revenge.

column1: The Blessing of Zim'Torga^77^All^Zul'Drak^Witch Doctor Khufu^Zim'Torga^^Too Much of a Good Thing^Blessing of Zim'Torga^Witch Doctor Khufu wants you to present 10 Drakkari Offerings to the statue of Zim'Torga.^Hexxer Ubungo probably told you about making offerings to the gods of Zul'Drak. Zim'Abwa is not the only god that stands forgotten by the Drakkari. We have taken refuge within the presence of Zim'Torga
column2: the Mother of Prosperity. As with Zim'Abwa
column3: if you were to give offerings of the Drakkari to her
column4: she is sure to give you her blessing.

column1: Chamber of Secrets^70^All^^Argent Emissary^Argent Emissary^^^^The Argent Dawn Emissary wants you to search the chamber of Tenris Mirkblood within the Servant's Quarters of Karazhan.^Excellent
column2: an experienced adventurer. Precisely what we need. There has been talk from the Kirin Tor guarding Medivh's tower that something is amiss with Karazhan. There is a new power lurking within
column3: one that answers neither to the Guardian's magic nor the Legion. From what they've scouted
column4: it appears it is an elven prince called Tenris Mirkblood
column5: and there is reason to believe he serves the Scourge. Go
column6: my friend
column7: investigate Mirkblood's chamber
column8: and return with any information you might find.

column1: Exterminate the Intruders^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Avatar of Freya^Avatar of Freya^^Cultist Incursion^The Lifewarden's Wrath^The Avatar of Freya at the Rainspeaker Rapids wants you to go to the Death's Hand Encampment to the northwest and slay 8 Cultist Infiltrators.^I am an embodiment of but one aspect of Freya
column2: daughter of the titans. I am the Lifewarden -- I was left here to protect this land against the threat of the Scourge. I never anticipated the Lich King would send willing living servants to do his work. I could easily crush these cultists myself
column3: but I am all that stands between the undead armies and the rest of the basin. Go
column4: <name>. Deliver my wrath to these insolent trespassers.

column1: The Emblazoned Runeblade^55^All^Death Knight^Instructor Razuvious^Instructor Razuvious^In Service Of The Lich King^^^Search the weapon racks in Ebon Hold for a Battle-worn Sword and then use it on a runeforge to craft a Runebladed Sword.^The single most important piece of equipment to a death knight is the runeblade. It is through the runeblade that a death knight commands the powers of frost
column2: blood and the unholy. The runeblade also acts as a vessel to store the death knight's runic power. The time has come to create your first runeblade. Search the weapon racks on this floor and locate a battle-worn sword. Once found
column3: take the sword to a nearby runeforge and use it to create a runeblade.

column1: The Lifewarden's Wrath^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Avatar of Freya^Avatar of Freya^The Lifewarden's Wrath^Exterminate the Intruders^^The Avatar of Freya at the Rainspeaker Rapids wants you to use Freya's Horn atop of the Glimmering Pillar.^We were not quick enough
column2: <name>. The cultist scum have arrived at the Glimmering Pillar and are making preparations to destroy it
column3: I can sense them. We don't have much time. Blow upon this horn atop the Glimmering Pillar to channel my power through the crystal. We shall show this scum to not trifle with the titans' creations.

column1: Freya's Pact^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Avatar of Freya^Avatar of Freya^The Lifewarden's Wrath^^^Listen to what the Avatar of Freya has to say.^The cultists have been taken care of
column2: but the Scourge's invasion has not slowed down. The situation is becoming desperate
column3: <name>. There exists a last resort. Before I reveal any more
column4: however
column5: I must be sure I have your absolute trust.

column1: The Leaders at Jin'Alai^77^All^Zul'Drak^Scalper Ahunae^Scalper Ahunae^The Leaders at Jin'Alai^^The Frozen Earth^Scalper Ahunae at Zim'Torga has asked you to retrieve the Treasure of Kutube'sa
column2: the Treasure of Gawanil
column3: and the Treasure of Chulo the Mad.^You thinkin' what Ahunae thinkin'
column4: mon? Some of the Drakkari trolls have gathered at the Pools of Jin'Alai to the southwest. We be needin' to draw out their leaders
column5: and Ahunae knows just how you be doin' it
column6: too! Go in there and kill those trolls. When you kill enough
column7: their leaders show up. When they show up next to their totems
column8: you make sure to be gettin' the treasure of Kutube'sa
column9: Gawanil
column10: and Chulo the Mad
column11: mon.

column1: To the Witch Doctor^77^All^Zul'Drak^Hexxer Ubungo^Witch Doctor Khufu^Too Much of a Good Thing^^^Speak with Witch Doctor Khufu at Zim'Torga.^We Zandalari could use your help
column2: <name>. We must put an end to what the Drakkari are doing to their gods! To the northeast
column3: up the great steps that lead to the next tier of Zul'Drak
column4: lies Zim'Torga. It is the home to another of the god statues and a refuge that my people are desparately attempting to defend. I would like for you to travel there and speak to Witch Doctor Khufu. Be warned though
column5: the place is under constant attack from the Drakkari.

column1: It Could Be Anywhere!^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Chad^Chad^^^^Look for a Golden Engagement Ring on the various creatures in Sholazar Basin.^When I found out that Miss Boulian was helping Nesingwary with his expedition
column2: I signed up as a deckhand immediately. You see
column3: I'd been meaning to marry her for months! I had it all planned out. I was going to propose the very night of the shipwreck... but now the ring is gone. I've searched everywhere! I know it might sound crazy
column4: but I know the engagement ring is in the Basin. If some Venture Company didn't steal it
column5: maybe a wild creature ate it. But it's here somewhere... I just know it!

column1: Breaking Through Jin'Alai^77^All^Zul'Drak^Witch Doctor Khufu^Witch Doctor Khufu^Too Much of a Good Thing^^To Speak With Har'koa^Witch Doctor Khufu at Zim'Torga has asked you to disturb the Blue Cauldron
column2: Green Cauldron
column3: Purple Cauldron
column4: and Red Cauldron.^I have been trying to commune with the gods. However
column5: the medicine men at the Pools of Jin'Alai are performing rituals that are interfering with my attempts. It is imperative that we break through their obtrusion. If you were to head southwest into the pools area
column6: I am certain that you would come across the cauldrons they are using for their magic. Disturb each of the cauldrons to bring down their ritual that is blocking me.

column1: To Speak With Har'koa^77^All^Zul'Drak^Witch Doctor Khufu^Har'koa^To Speak With Har'koa^Breaking Through Jin'Alai^^Speak with Har'koa at the Altar of Har'koa.^The gods have spoken
column2: <name>. We now know what you must do. You must now go to the Altar of Har'koa to the southeast and speak with the leopard goddess.

column1: You Can Run
column2: But You Can't Hide^75^All^Zul'Drak^Stefan Vadu^Stefan Vadu^An Invitation
column3: of Sorts...^^^Stefan in Ebon Watch asked you to go to the Reliquary of Agony to collect 5 Putrid Abomination Guts from the Putrid Abominations and 5 Gooey Ghoul Drools.^Once the Scourge have a target in their sights
column4: they'll stop at nothing to acquire it. You're doomed to a mindless existence as a walking corpse.... <Stefan's face twists into a cruel grin.> ... unless we can use their desires against them. I'll explain later. I have complex magic to prepare which requires certain material components. Travel due east of here to the Reliquary of Agony. Slay abominations and gather the ghoul drool you'll find there then return to me with their remnants.

column1: Kickin' Nass and Takin' Manes^75^All^Zul'Drak^Stefan Vadu^Stefan Vadu^In Search Of Answers^^Taking a Stand^Stefan in Ebon Watch wants you to use Nass to collect 10 hair samples from Withered Trolls.^Before you meet Nass
column2: there's something you should know. He got a toxic dose of blight back in the day
column3: and now he's deaf
column4: blind
column5: and mostly numb. It's not all bad
column6: though. He's virtually immune to the stuff now
column7: which makes him perfect for certain tasks - like the one I'm about to give you. There are many freshly scourged trolls nearby and we need to study the blight's effect on them. Take Nass
column8: and this boot. When you've slain a troll
column9: give him a good kick and he'll know to take a hair sample.

column1: An Invitation
column2: of Sorts...^75^All^Zul'Drak^Unliving Choker^Stefan Vadu^An Invitation
column3: of Sorts...^^^Take the Unliving Choker to Stefan at Ebon Watch.^Crafted of bone and dripping with blood
column4: this choker is of intricate and deliberate design. Gazing upon it overwhelms you with an ominous presence - one that compels you to wear it. You fight the urge
column5: and resolve to bring it back to Ebon Watch. If anyone can explain this
column6: a death knight can....

column1: But First My Offspring^77^All^Zul'Drak^Har'koa^Har'koa^To Speak With Har'koa^^Spirit of Rhunok
column2: The Blessing of Zim'Rhuk^Har'koa has asked you to use her whisker on the corpses of her children to free and resurrect them. Return to her at the Altar of Har'koa when you are done.^I am the last of the gods to be subdued
column3: so we must first attempt to free the others. Bound by the magics of my subduers
column4: I am unable to discern their fates. But first
column5: I would ask that you do me a kindness. Already the Drakkari turn my magic against me. They have transformed my offspring into monstrosities. Take one of my whiskers. Slay my tortured children and use the magic of it to release them from their nightmare
column6: and bring them back to life.

column1: Darkness Calling^75^All^Zul'Drak^Writhing Choker^Stefan Vadu^Darkness Calling^Cleansing Drak'Tharon^^Take the Writhing Choker to Stefan in Ebon Watch.^Crafted of bone and dripping with blood
column2: this choker is of intricate and deliberate design. Gazing upon it overwhelms you with an ominous presence - one that compels you to wear it. You fight the urge
column3: and resolve to bring it back to Ebon Watch. If anyone can explain this
column4: a death knight can....

column1: Some Make Lemonade
column2: Some Make Liquor^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^Some Make Lemonade
column3: Some Make Liquor^^^Bring 1 Orange
column4: 2 Banana Bunches
column5: and 1 Papaya to Grimbooze Thunderbrew at the Nesingwary Base Camp.^Life's tossed me a cartload of lemons this time! When the ship ran aground
column6: the kegs carrying my best brew burst! All we have now are a few bottles of rum
column7: and it won't sustain a thirsty expedition! We need to get some booze cooking
column8: and fast!! The trees in the Wildgrowth Mangal
column9: to the east
column10: seem laden with fruit
column11: but it's too high for me to reach. Look for good
column12: strong vines
column13: see if you can use it to shake some of that fruit out of the trees. Bring me whatever you can find.

column1: Relics of the Snow Leopard Goddess^77^All^Zul'Drak^Chronicler To'kini^Chronicler To'kini^^^Plundering Their Own
column2: Tails Up^Chronicler To'kini at Zim'Torga wants you to recover 10 Har'koan Relics.^I overheard that you are going to see to the well-being of Har'koa. Good luck to you. I am wondering if while you are in the vicinity of the altar
column3: you would be willing to recover their relics? I do not require many
column4: and it is only a short trip to the southeast. What do you say?

column1: The Eye Of Acherus^55^All^Death Knight^Instructor Razuvious^The Lich King^In Service Of The Lich King^^^Report to the Lich King in Ebon Hold.^Behold
column2: Acherus
column3: the grand citadel of death! It has no equal in this world! Not even the mighty Naxxramas could withstand a direct assault from the Ebon Hold. Looming above the face of the necropolis is the all-seeing eye of Acherus. From it the master is able to see great distances into the territories held by our enemies. What the eye sees
column4: the Lich King sees
column5: and now the time has come for you to peer through the eye! The Lich King has called for you
column6: <name>. Go now! Suffer well
column7: <brother/sister>...

column1: Near Miss^75^All^Zul'Drak^Stefan Vadu^Stefan Vadu^An Invitation
column2: of Sorts...^^^Stefan at Ebon Watch wants you to take the Unliving Choker to Bloodrose Datura.^It was either wisdom or luck that prevented you from wearing this choker
column3: <race>. Either way
column4: your acquiring it was no random occurance. You've been targeted by someone
column5: or something.... Take your choker to Bloodrose
column6: here. Let her demonstrate the fate that nearly befell you.

column1: Close Call^75^All^Zul'Drak^Stefan Vadu^Stefan Vadu^Darkness Calling^^^Stefan at Ebon Watch wants you to take the Writhing Choker to Bloodrose Datura.^It was either wisdom or luck that prevented you from wearing this choker
column2: <race>. Either way
column3: your acquiring it was no random occurence. You've been targeted by someone
column4: or something.... Take your choker to Bloodrose
column5: here. Let her demonstrate the fate that nearly befell you.

column1: The Frozen Earth^77^All^Zul'Drak^Element-Tamer Dagoda^Element-Tamer Dagoda^^The Leaders at Jin'Alai^^Element-Tamer Dagoda at Zim'Torga wants you to collect 7 Essence of the Frozen Earth.^We captured these elementals from nearby
column2: and I have plenty of defenders now. But
column3: it takes a great deal of power to make them strong enough to stand up to our enemies. The frozen earth at Drak'Mabwa to the northwest have what I need to maintain our defenses. I'll need more of their essence if I'm to keep this up.

column1: Sealing the Rifts^77^All^Zul'Drak^Scalper Ahunae^Scalper Ahunae^The Leaders at Jin'Alai^^^Scalper Ahunae at Zim'Torga has asked you to seal 7 Elemental Rifts.^Dagoda gonna be sendin' you northwest to Drak'Mabwa to get her more stuff for her defenders if she didn't already. While you up there
column2: Ahunae be wantin' you to destroy the rifts those elementals pourin' out of. The last thing we needin' is for them to attack us! Just watch out
column3: more of those frozen earth'll show up when you try to seal the rifts.

column1: Death Comes From On High^55^All^Death Knight^The Lich King^The Lich King^In Service Of The Lich King^^^The Lich King commands you to use the Eye of Acherus to analyze the Scarlet Hold
column2: New Avalon Forge
column3: New Avalon Town Hall and the Chapel of the Crimson Flame.^Towering above this platform is the eye of Acherus. From it you will call forth a probe that you will then use to analyze Scarlet Crusade fortifications at New Avalon. The eye has a host of powers that should make the acquisition of this data simple. Use the eye's siphon to analyze the forge
column4: town hall
column5: hold
column6: and chapel. The eye's control mechanisms are located on either side of this platform. Waste no more time
column7: <name>. The Scourge will have this place. The Lich King commands it!

column1: Spirit of Rhunok^77^All^Zul'Drak^Har'koa^Spirit of Rhunok^Spirit of Rhunok^But First My Offspring^^Speak with the Spirit of Rhunok at the Altar of Rhunok.^My feelings tell me that Rhunok doesn't have much time. I can tell that the arctic bear god's spirit has already separated from his weakened body. It is his spirit with which you must commune. His altar lies to the northwest beyond Drak'Mabwa.

Silver Lining^75^All^Zul'Drak^Stefan Vadu^Stefan Vadu^Darkness Calling^^^Stefan in Ebon Watch asked you to go to the Reliquary of Agony to collect 5 Putrid Abomination Guts from the Putrid Abominations and 5 Gooey Ghoul Drools.^Once the Scourge have a target in their sights
column2: they'll stop at nothing to acquire it. You're doomed to a mindless existence as a walking corpse.... <Stefan's face twists into a cruel grin.> ... unless we can use their desires against them. I'll explain later. I have complex magic to prepare which requires certain material components. Travel due east of here to the land beneath the Reliquary of Agony. Slay the ghouls and abominations you'll find there and return to me with their remnants.

column1: Still At It^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^Some Make Lemonade
column2: Some Make Liquor^^^Successfully complete the distillation process and bring the completed Thunderbrew's Jungle Punch to Grimbooze Thunderbrew at the Nesingwary Base Camp.^Now that we've got the raw materials
column3: I've had my assistant ready the still. He'll oversee the process
column4: but I want you to help keep everything under control. You might be tempted to think that we just throw everything into the still and let it sit
column5: but you're wrong. Ingredients and heat need to be added at certain times
column6: and the pressure regulated at others. You'll have no more than 10 seconds to react to a situation. Speak with "Tipsy" McManus when you're ready to start distilling.

column1: The Taste Test^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^Grimbooze Thunderbrew^Some Make Lemonade
column2: Some Make Liquor^^Fletcher's Lost and Found^Offer a sample of Thunderbrew's Jungle Punch to Hemet Nesingwary
column3: Hadrius Harlowe
column4: and Tamara Wobblesprocket
column5: then return to Grimbooze Thunderbrew at the Nesingwary Base Camp.^And now for the moment of truth! <Grimbooze chuckles.> I've always wanted to say that. Normally
column6: I'd debut a new drink at a banquet
column7: but we can't have one in the middle of the jungle. Instead
column8: just take samples to a few trusted friends and return with their comments. Let's see
column9: we'll definitely want Hemet Nesingwary's opinion
column10: and Hadrius Harlowe's
column11: too. They're here in camp. You'll want to head over to Lakeside Landing
column12: near the center of the Basin and offer Tamara Wobblesprocket a taste.

column1: My Prophet
column2: My Enemy^77^All^Zul'Drak^Spirit of Rhunok^Spirit of Rhunok^Spirit of Rhunok^^^The Spirit of Rhunok at the Altar of Rhunok has asked you to acquire his Arctic Bear God Mojo.^My prophet absorbed too much of my power too quickly
column3: and subsequently killed himself. You can see the results at the water-filled crater to the south in Drak'Mabwa. My former priests have already resurrected him so that he can finish the job. They're channeling my power back into him
column4: and it will not be long now before he reawakens. You must put an end to him and return with my mojo before it is too late.

column1: An End to the Suffering^77^All^Zul'Drak^Spirit of Rhunok^Spirit of Rhunok^Spirit of Rhunok^^^The Spirit of Rhunok has asked you to use the Tormentor's Incense to awaken his body. You are then to slay Rhunok using the power that his spirit has imbued you with.^My body is too far gone now
column2: <name>. It is only a matter of time before a new prophet is elevated and finishes what the other began. I am going to imbue you with the last of my power. The tormentor inside the altar building carries incense
column3: which will awaken my body and make it vulnerable. Use the incense and do me the kindness of putting an end to my suffering. I apologize if I fight back. Even for me
column4: the will to survive is strong.
