column1: Dressing Down^75^All^Zul'Drak^Stefan Vadu^Stefan Vadu^An Invitation
column2: of Sorts...^^Infiltrating Voltarus^Stefan at Ebon Watch wants you to use the Ensorceled Choker to apply the Scourge disguise.^There... I've created a disguise that should make you indistinguishable from the Scourge. You'll be free to walk among them as long as the disguise holds. Only the blightguards will be able to see through my illusion. Watch out for them! Another thing you must know is that the disguise is unstable and may drop unexpectedly
column3: so stay alert. Let's test it out. Use the choker and visit the Scourge merchant just east of here. Return to me with a bottle of bitter plasma.

column1: Suit Up!^75^All^Zul'Drak^Stefan Vadu^Stefan Vadu^Darkness Calling^^Infiltrating Voltarus
column2: Reunited^Stefan at Ebon Watch wants you to use the Ensorcelled Choker to apply the Scourge disguise.^There... I've created a disguise that should make you indistinguishable from the Scourge. You'll be free to walk among them as long as the disguise holds. Only the blightguards will be able to see through my illusion. Watch out for them! Another thing you must know is that the disguise is unstable and may drop unexpectedly
column3: so stay alert. Let's test it out. Use the choker and visit the Scourge vendor just east of here. Return to me with a bottle of bitter plasma.

column1: Plundering Their Own^77^All^Zul'Drak^Chronicler To'kini^Chronicler To'kini^^Relics of the Snow Leopard Goddess^^Chronicler To'kini at Zim'Torga wants you to recover 7 Rhunokian Artifacts.^There is another altar nearby where there are artifacts to be saved. It is said that the Drakkari at the Altar of Rhunok to the northwest
column2: beyond the broken tundra of Drak'Mabwa
column3: have already plundered their own holy site. <class>
column4: I would be appreciative if you could rescue those artifacts from their undeserving hands.

column1: Lakeside Landing^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Hemet Nesingwary^Tamara Wobblesprocket^^The Great Hunter's Challenge^^Speak with Tamara Wobblesprocket at Lakeside Landing.^When the trouble with the Venture Company started
column2: I asked Marvin Wobblesprocket and his wife
column3: Tamara
column4: to take their flying machines east to River's Heart. I asked them to setup a small camp there so that we could use them as a relay to fly in supplies and survey the area. They should have arrived by now and started setting up. River's Heart is near the center of the basin where the rivers converge. Search for Lakeshore Landing on the northeast shore. Marvin mentioned it would be the best spot.

column1: Feedin' Da Goolz^75^ ^Zul'Drak^Gristlegut^Gristlegut^^^^Gristlegut at the Reliquary of Agony wants you to use Bowels and Brains Bowl next to 10 Decaying Ghouls.^Git o'er heer
column2: gool! Yeh
column3: I talkin' to yoo. It feedin' time now. Gotta git da grub ta all da gools! Speshal grub dis time! Bowels an' brainz bowl... num
column4: num
column5: num. Jus drop da bowl nexta da gool. Gud way ta make frenz. Yoo got goolfrenz? Ha
column6: ha
column7: hah!

column1: Back to Har'koa^77^All^Zul'Drak^Spirit of Rhunok^Har'koa^Spirit of Rhunok^^^Speak with Har'koa at the Altar of Har'koa.^And now it is time for you to return to the leopard goddess. Somehow I sense that she has other plans for you. Tell her that no matter what
column2: we are eternal.

column1: The Part-time Hunter^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Tamara Wobblesprocket^Tamara Wobblesprocket^^^^Bring Pitch's Remains to Tamara Wobblesprocket at Lakeside Landing.^When Hemet asked me to accompany Marvin out here
column2: I hoped that I might have the opportunity to work on my own hunting skills in between repairing the flying machines and setting up the camp. I wanted to take down a ferocious lion named Pitch. He's said to make his home south of here
column3: near where the Wildgrowth Mangal meets the northern face of the Skyreach Pillar. If you can find the beast
column4: would you bring back his remains? If the rumors are true
column5: they'd make a trophy even Hemet will respect!

column1: The Blessing of Zim'Rhuk^77^All^Zul'Drak^Witch Doctor Khufu^Zim'Rhuk^^But First My Offspring^Blessing of Zim'Rhuk^Witch Doctor Khufu wants you to present 10 Drakkari Offerings to the statue of Zim'Rhuk.^There is another god of Zul'Drak that is being neglected. Zim'Rhuk's statue lies directly to the north. Known as "The Wise One"
column2: Zim'Rhuk is also known to be very protective of his domain. He maintains guardians that deal harshly with anyone that does not have the wits to slip past them. Avoid the guardians and give the Drakkari offerings to Zim'Rhuk so that you will benefit from his blessing.

column1: The Might Of The Scourge^55^All^Death Knight^The Lich King^Highlord Darion Mograine^In Service Of The Lich King^^The Power Of Blood
column2: Frost And Unholy^The Lich King commands you to carry his orders to Highlord Darion Mograine at Ebon Hold.^Listen well
column3: death knight
column4: for I give to you the words that will start a war. My final judgment has been passed: Death. To. All. None shall stand so boldly against the might of the Scourge without reprisal! As you have served me well in your first task
column5: so too shall you serve me in your next task. Take my judgment to Highlord Mograine at the command post of Acherus
column6: found on the first floor. Tell him to begin the assault. And when the Crusade has been dealt with
column7: we will finish off the Argent Dawn.

column1: My Pet Roc^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Zootfizzle^Zootfizzle^^Sharpening Your Talons^^Bring 7 Roc Eggs to Zootfizzle at Dorian's Outpost.^Dorian's had me training and feeding the baby drakes he captures
column2: and it has gotten me thinking. I want a pet of my own! No
column3: not a juvenile drake. I don't want a pet capable of biting my hand off! However
column4: in the Bonefields to the northeast of the camp
column5: beyond the area dominated by the drakes
column6: there's a large population of goretalon rocs. The grown ones are beyond hope of domesticating
column7: but if you bring me the eggs from their nests
column8: I can raise them from the time they hatch.

column1: Scalps!^77^All^Zul'Drak^Scalper Ahunae^Scalper Ahunae^The Leaders at Jin'Alai^^^Scalper Ahunae at Zim'Torga wants you to use Ahunae's Knife to scalp 10 Heb'Drakkar trolls.^I thinkin' it be time to do some scalpin'
column2: mon! The trolls at Heb'Drakkar to the northeast should do nicely. With their fancy bats and attackin' us
column3: they got it comin'! Ahunae even give you his own knife so that you do the job right.

column1: Weapons of Destruction^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Avatar of Freya^Avatar of Freya^^Cultist Incursion^^The Avatar of Freya wants you to go to the Death's Hand Encampment to the northwest and destroy 4 Unstable Explosives.^The Lich King's lackeys have dared to bring weapons of destruction into my domain. I will not stand for this. Go to their outpost to the north and destroy the weapons they would use against the land. We cannot let the Scourge taint another inch of these sacred lands.
Infiltrating Voltarus^75^All^Zul'Drak^Stefan Vadu^Stefan Vadu^An Invitation
column2: of Sorts...^^^Stefan wants you to use your Ensorcelled Choker to get into Voltarus and do whatever the Scourge leader there asks of you.^By now you've probably guessed the details of my plan. We're using the Scourge's interest in you against them. You're going undercover. I know it's likely a death sentence
column3: but if we do nothing your death is a certainty. Travel northeast to Reliquary of Pain and stand on the platform while wearing your disguise. Once inside Voltarus
column4: you must earn the trust of the Scourge commander. When you've completed your mission
column5: blow this horn and I'll fly to your location to receive your report.

column1: Bringing Down Heb'Jin^77^All^Zul'Drak^Element-Tamer Dagoda^Element-Tamer Dagoda^^^^Element-Tamer Dagoda at Zim'Torga wants you to kill Heb'Jin.^<Dagoda looks at Ahunae and sighs.> You want to really deal with Heb'Drakkar? Collecting scalps isn't going to get the job done. You have to take out their leader
column2: Heb'Jin. The problem is
column3: he's up on the bat rookery goading his forces on. Bang his drum and I guarantee that he'll fly down. That's when you kill him. You can take this net we got from one of his headhunters. Use it to trap his bat when he lands. That way you won't have to fight both of them.

column1: Reunited^75^All^Zul'Drak^Overlord Drakuru^Overlord Drakuru^^Suit Up!^^Drakuru in Voltarus wants you to speak to Gorebag and take the tour of Zul'Drak.^<name>! Ya musta received mah gift! Turn around
column2: mon
column3: lemme get a good look at ya... Ahh
column4: ya make me proud. We come such a long way
column5: you and I
column6: and now we be servin' da Lich King together. Stick with me and big things be comin
column7: mon. Big things... but first
column8: we need to be gettin' ya caught up. So much been happenin' since I saw ya last. Go speak ta Gorebag for a tour of Zul'Drak. Listen for me and I'll tell ya all ya be needin' ta know.

column1: Dark Horizon^75^All^Zul'Drak^Overlord Drakuru^Overlord Drakuru^^^^Drakuru in Voltarus wants you to speak to Gorebag and take the tour of Zul'Drak.^Ahh
column2: another supplicant answerin' da Lich King's call. <Drakuru sniffs you.> Freshly scourged
column3: eh? Ya still be reekin' of da living! Long be da line of dem who seek da Lich King's blessings. Ya must rise above da masses and prove yerself worthy of wieldin' true power. Lookin' down over Zul'Drak
column4: I sensed potential in ya. I ordered your - invitation. Da rest be up ta you.... Go an' speak ta Gorebag for a tour of Zul'Drak. Dere be much ta do if you're to be of any worth to me.

column1: I Sense a Disturbance^77^All^Zul'Drak^Har'koa^Har'koa^Spirit of Rhunok^^^Har'koa has asked you to determine what has happened to Quetz'lun. Speak to her to be able to ride one of her children stealthily into the Altar of Quetz'lun.^There's something wrong with Quetz'lun
column2: the wind serpent goddess. What it is exactly I cannot sense
column3: but I do know that her altar has been overrun with powerful creatures. I'm going to send you there on the back of one of my children
column4: which you saved. The two of you will move swiftly and with great stealth to uncover what has become of Quetz'lun. My child will see you safely back to me. Just keep your eyes open. When you are ready
column5: ask and I will call one of my kittens for you.

column1: Preparations for the Underworld^77^All^Zul'Drak^Har'koa^Har'koa^Spirit of Rhunok^^^Har'koa wants you to collect 8 Sacred Adornments. Deliver them to her at the Altar of Har'koa.^Quetz'lun may be dead
column2: but I can still feel her spirit lingering in the underworld at the altar. We have to find a way to get you to her. Luckily for us
column3: I just happen to have a supply of former supplicants at hand who are no longer in need of their sacred adornments. Both my subduers and claws are likely to still be wearing them. Bring the adornments to me and I'll draw upon their energy to enable you to cross over into Quetz'lun's underworld nightmare.

column1: Seek the Wind Serpent Goddess^77^All^Zul'Drak^Har'koa^Quetz'lun's Spirit^Spirit of Rhunok^^^Seek Quetz'lun's Spirit at the Altar of Quetz'lun.^You are prepared
column2: but I'm not certain that you're ready for what is to come. When you cross back over into Quetz'lun's altar area
column3: you will enter the realm of the dead. From what I can feel of it
column4: it's not going to be pleasant. Try not to be distracted by what you see in there. Simply head for the altar building and seek out Quetz'lun's Spirit.

column1: Foundation for Revenge^77^All^Zul'Drak^Quetz'lun's Spirit^Quetz'lun's Spirit^Spirit of Rhunok^^^Quetz'lun's Spirit has tasked you with the destruction of 12 trolls
column2: either Quetz'lun Worshippers or Serpent-Touched Berserkers
column3: near her Soul Fonts.^I have something special planned for my favorite high priests. But first you get to prove yourself in laying the foundation for my revenge. You do still want to live
column4: yes? As you have seen
column5: my devotees are enjoying their stay here
column6: but now it's time for them to make final restitution. Do me the smallest of favors if you would
column7: <name>. Lure them near my soul fonts and then put an end to their existences. They taste so delicious
column8: and their sacrifice will not go in vain
column9: I can assure you.

column1: So Far
column2: So Bad^75^All^Zul'Drak^Stefan Vadu^Stefan Vadu^An Invitation
column3: of Sorts...^^^Stefan at Ebon Watch wants you to return to Drakuru and complete any tasks he has for you.^Everything you've reported is consistent with what we know. Learning of Drakuru and earning his trust will lay the groundwork for your future missions. Return to him and do as he says. Do whatever you must to appear sincere
column4: <name>. A great deal is riding upon your performance. This time I'm adding an additional assignment: While you're in the field
column5: pour this additive into their blight cauldrons. It should neutralize the scourging agent and render the batch useless.

column1: The Scarlet Harvest^55^All^Death Knight^Scourge Commander Thalanor^Prince Valanar^In Service Of The Lich King^^Tonight We Dine In Havenshire
column2: Grand Theft Palomino
column3: Abandoned Mail
column4: Death's Challenge^Report to Prince Valanar at Death's Breach.^Below Acherus stands Death's Breach
column5: the staging point for our assault upon the Scarlet Crusade. You are to ride one of my Scourge gryphons
column6: located on either side of this platform
column7: and report to Prince Valanar. Do as he says and you may live to see these lands fall before us.

column1: Reconnaissance Flight^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Pilot Vic^Pilot Vic^An Embarassing Incident^^^Help Pilot Vic complete the Reconnaissance Flight.^It's about time we had planes up and running in this place. The professor's been asking me to check out a strange weather pattern coming from the northeast. Thing is
column2: I'm going to need a co-pilot if we're going into uncharted territory. No way in hell I'm heading out there alone. What do you say
column3: <tough-guy /hotshot>? You might learn a thing or two. And once you learn to deal with the northern winds... you can pretty much fly anywhere.

column1: Setting the Stage^77^All^Zul'Drak^Quetz'lun's Spirit^Quetz'lun's Spirit^Spirit of Rhunok^^^Quetz'lun's Spirit has demanded that you collect 10 Underworld Power Fragments. Return to her at the Altar of Quetz'lun only when you have done so.^I will give you a chance at continued existence. There are fragments of the power that fueled my curse scattered about the altar grounds. It is my desire that you collect some of them for me. Not so many that the curse will be lifted
column2: but enough that I will be able to eventually make use of them to exact revenge upon my prophet. Go
column3: insect. Run and do my bidding before I change my mind about letting you live.

column1: It Rolls Downhill^75^All^Zul'Drak^Overlord Drakuru^Overlord Drakuru^^^^Overlord Drakuru in Voltarus wants you to use the Scepter of Suggestion on the Blight Geists and then order them to harvest 7 Blight Crystals.^If ya ever gonna be worthy of da Lich King's gifts
column2: ya must learn ta be a great leader - one who be commandin' respect! I got a task dat gonna refine your command skills
column3: mon.... Summa my minions be trained ta harvest blight crystals from da land below
column4: but dey be lazy and slow. You gonna be in charge o' dem
column5: mon. Take dis scepter and teach 'em how to get da job done. When dey be under your control
column6: make 'em harvest dem crystals!

column1: Hell Hath a Fury^77^All^Zul'Drak^Quetz'lun's Spirit^Quetz'lun's Spirit^Spirit of Rhunok^^^Quetz'lun's Spirit at the Altar of Quetz'lun wants you to use Quetz'lun's Hexxing Stick upon High Priest Mu'funu
column2: High Priestess Tua-Tua
column3: and High Priest Hawinni. Once you have done this
column4: slay them.^It is now time for you to punish my three high priests: Mu'funu
column5: Tua-Tua
column6: and Hawinni. You'll find them spread around the altar grounds. Take this hexxing stick. I've empowered it with my rage and indignation. I'm sure that it will prove potent. Just use it and proceed to destroy them. The hex will take care of the rest. <Quetz'lun displays a toothy grin.> Succeed and I may let you go. Fail and die.

column1: One Last Thing^77^All^Zul'Drak^Quetz'lun's Spirit^Har'koa^Spirit of Rhunok^^^Deliver the Underworld Power Fragments to Har'koa and beseech her for a portion of her spirit. You will still find her at the Altar of Har'koa.^There is one last thing that is needed to enact the final revenge against my prophet. The power fragments you collected must be imbued with a portion of a living gods' spirit. You're going to need to beseech Har'koa for some of hers. Once you've done that
column2: when you return here
column3: you will not come to the underworld. Instead
column4: you will return to the physical world of my altar. My children and guardians will no longer attack you
column5: and you'll be able to get to my prophet without having to worry about them.

column1: Sabotage^75^All^Zul'Drak^Stefan Vadu^Stefan Vadu^An Invitation
column2: of Sorts...^^^Stefan at Ebon Watch wants you to perform another task for Drakuru.^While we're working to discover the purpose of these crystals
column3: we need you back in Voltarus doing Drakuru's bidding. Every task you perform successfully gets you closer to him
column4: and brings us that much nearer to knowing his mind. While you're there
column5: I have another mission for you. Drakuru's Scourgewagons pose a significant threat. We need them destroyed. Make your way to the wagons and activate these charges. Once they're set
column6: get clear! The explosion will expose you if you're too close.

column1: Hazardous Materials^75^All^Zul'Drak^Stefan Vadu^Stefan Vadu^An Invitation
column2: of Sorts...^^^Stefan at Ebon Watch wants you to go to Voltarus and complete any tasks Drakuru has for you. While there
column3: you are to steal 5 Harvested Blight Crystals.^Blight crystals?! What could this scumbag Drakuru be up to? Clearly
column4: he's working on something significant. Continue to do his bidding and perhaps once he's more familiar with you he'll reveal his plans. In the meantime
column5: we need to have a look at these crystals. While you're in Voltarus
column6: try to get some samples of the harvested crystals when no one's looking. Be alert! Handling those crystals can trigger your disguise to fail.

column1: If Chaos Drives
column2: Let Suffering Hold The Reins^55^All^Death Knight^Prince Valanar^Prince Valanar^In Service Of The Lich King^^Gothik the Harvester^Prince Valanar at Death's Breach commands you to slay 10 Scarlet Crusaders or Scarlet Peasants and 10 Citizens of Havenshire.^They make their stand now
column3: outside of Death's Breach
column4: futilely attempting to push us back in hopes of saving their horses
column5: mines
column6: lumber and citizens. This will be your first lesson in Scourge warfare: TERROR! Go to the front lines
column7: south of here
column8: and destroy Scarlet Crusaders. Leave their corpses so that we may utilize them for the death march. But most importantly: kill the fleeing villagers. Soldiers dying are an affordance
column9: but villagers? That is what strikes fear into the hearts of man.

column1: Tonight We Dine In Havenshire^55^All^Death Knight^Orithos the Sky Darkener^Orithos the Sky Darkener^^The Scarlet Harvest^Gothik the Harvester^Orithos the Sky Darkener at Death's Breach wants you to recover 15 Saronite Arrows.^The Sky Darkeners are mindless constructs with one purpose: KILL! Specifically
column2: they are aiming to kill any man or woman that they see fleeing Havenshire for the safety of New Avalon. We certainly can't allow those cowards to make it to safety and then take up arms against us! There is one slight problem. They use saronite arrows for maximum range and damage. Saronite
column3: however
column4: is a metal only found in Northrend
column5: so supplies are limited! Retrieve those arrows for me and I will reward you handsomely.

column1: Grand Theft Palomino^55^All^Death Knight^Salanar the Horseman^Salanar the Horseman^Grand Theft Palomino^The Scarlet Harvest^^Salanar the Horseman asks that you steal a horse from the Havenshire Stables and return it to him at Death's Breach.^How fortuitous it is that the Crusade has a stable full of horses a mere stone's throw from this post. Though they guard it tenaciously
column2: an enterprising young death knight could break through their defenses and take what is rightfully <his/hers>! Once you acquire a horse from the Havenshire Stables
column3: return it to me and I will see what can be done about transforming it into a proper deathcharger. Remember
column4: <name>
column5: it's only stealing if you're caught. Watch out for that deranged stable master
column6: Kitrik!

column1: Reagent Agent^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Colvin Norrington^Colvin Norrington^^Sharpening Your Talons^^Bring 5 Twisted Roc Claws to Colvin Norrington at Dorian's Outpost.^That Archmage Pentarus
column2: back in Dalaran
column3: will be expecting us to return with all kinds of reagents and talismans. It seems the locals are fond of animal parts. Twisted claws from the goretalon rocs are among their favorite. It's not my place to say whether the rumors are true or not
column4: but I've a feeling there's something here. The rocs live in the Bonefields off to the northeast
column5: where they feed on the corpses of old mammoths. Will you help me gather talons for the archmage's research?

column1: Burning to Help^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Colvin Norrington^Colvin Norrington^^Sharpening Your Talons^^Colvin Norrington at Dorian's Outpost wants you to take 5 Hydra Sputum Samples and kill 5 Bittertide Hydra.^There's no more caustic material in all of the basin than bittertide hydra sputum. I've got special containers to collect just such a thing for Archmage Pentarus' studies. Now all I need is a brave
column2: um... collector. You look like a hardy
column3: adventurous <class>. How'd you like to make a bit of money and aid Dalaran's cause at the same time? All you need to do is take this container with you to Bittertide Lake
column4: to the southwest. Engage the hydra and use the container to sample the sputum they shower you with.

column1: Blood of a Dead God^77^All^Zul'Drak^Har'koa^Har'koa^Spirit of Rhunok^^You Reap What You Sow^Har'koa has asked you to collect 7 Blood of Mam'toth. Return them to her at the Altar of Har'koa.^Mam'toth
column2: the god of the mammoths
column3: destroyed himself
column4: and took much of his temple with him
column5: rather than allowing his trolls to gain his power. If I'm to sacrifice a portion of my spirit
column6: I will need something with which to bolster myself. Mam'toth left behind an enormous crater to the northeast
column7: just north of the Altar of Quetz'lun. Within the crater his blood yet lives. Bring it to me.

column1: You Reap What You Sow^77^All^Zul'Drak^Har'koa^Witch Doctor Khufu^^Blood of a Dead God^Wooly Justice
column2: Enchanted Tiki Warriors
column3: Hexed Caches
column4: The Key of Warlord Zol'Maz^Slay the Drained Prophet of Quetz'lun and then inform Witch Doctor Khufu at Zim'Torga.^This is what it has come down to... revenge. <Har'koa sighs.> Take this ritual kit and enact it near Quetz'lun's corpse upon her altar. If everything works properly
column5: her spirit should be drawn into the material world where she will be able to reclaim her power from the prophet. The rest will be up to you
column6: <name>. You must slay the prophet in his drained state.

column1: Lambs To The Slaughter^55^All^Death Knight^Baron Rivendare^Baron Rivendare^^The Crypt of Remembrance^^Baron Rivendare at the Crypt of Remembrance has commanded you to slay 10 Scarlet Crusade Soldiers and 15 Citizens of New Avalon.^Most humans would have fled the moment a Scourge necropolis took up residence in their air space. Not the Scarlet Crusade! I must confess - I rather enjoy our exchanges with the Crusade. Through the years
column2: Scourge battles against them have resulted in several of the most tragic events in human history. Yet here we stand - AGAIN - locked in battle! We shan't deny them the pleasures of eternal servitude to the Lich King! Enter New Avalon and fulfill their death wish. Leave no survivors.

column1: Behind Scarlet Lines^55^All^Death Knight^Prince Keleseth^Orbaz Bloodbane^Behind Scarlet Lines^How To Win Friends And Influence Enemies^Brothers In Death^Report to Orbaz Bloodbane at the Scarlet Tavern in New Avalon.^I have sent Orbaz

column1: The Path Of The Righteous Crusader^55^All^Death Knight^Orbaz Bloodbane^Orbaz Bloodbane^Behind Scarlet Lines^^^Orbaz Bloodbane at the Scarlet Tavern in New Avalon has ordered you to steal the New Avalon Patrol Schedule from the Scarlet Hold.^We haven't got a damned clue about when or where this courier is supposed to show up. None of these humans had an answer either. <Orbaz points to the Scarlet corpses strewn across the floor.> I did manage to beat something useful out of the last one. Inside Scarlet Hold they keep a schedule of all patrol routes. I want you to break into the hold and steal the schedule. The hold is the largest building in New Avalon - northeast of here.

Brothers In Death^55^All^Death Knight^Thassarian^Koltira Deathweaver^Brothers In Death^Behind Scarlet Lines^^Search for Koltira Deathweaver in the Scarlet Hold.^Breaking through the Scarlet lines was no easy task. We suffered many casualties during the assault and lost one of our best death knights

column4: northeast of here. Tear that keep asunder

column1: Bloody Breakout^55^All^Death Knight^Koltira Deathweaver^Thassarian^Brothers In Death^^^Slay High Inquisitor Valroth and take Valroth's Head to Thassarian at the Scarlet Tavern in New Avalon.^The alarms have been sounded. column3: and 3 members of the Mistwhisper Tribe. You may blood the sword on either Mistwhisper Oracles or Mistwhisper Warriors. column4: but old tradition say sword need to be blooded first. Older warrior usually do that. You do this honor for Rejek? Take blade
column5: put in corpses of all Frenzyheart foes: wasps and hardknuckles to southwest
column6: and the big-tongues. Maybe blood blade on Mistwhispers
column7: far to northwest near Bittertide Lake.

column1: A Cleansing Song^80^All^Sholazar Basin^Oracle Soo-nee^Oracle Soo-nee^^Return of the Friendly Dryskin^^Soo-nee
column2: at the Rainspeaker Canopy
column3: wants you to play the Cleansing Chime at Bittertide Lake
column4: Wintergrasp River and River's Heart and slay the evil spirits that plague the waters there.^Earth in Sholazar is pure. The pillars have protected the land for centuries. Water
column5: not as pure
column6: it comes from outside Sholazar.... from oceans
column7: from lakes
column8: from rivers. Water sometimes bring bad spirits - need to be cleansed. You take this chime and play at Bittertide Lake
column9: Wintergrasp River and River's Heart. It make bad spirit angry... and then you must kill it.

column1: Song of Reflection^80^All^Sholazar Basin^Oracle Soo-nee^Oracle Soo-nee^^Return of the Friendly Dryskin^^Soo-nee at Rainspeaker Canopy wants you to use the Didgeridoo of Contemplation at the top of the Glimmering Pillar
column2: the Suntouched Pillar
column3: the Mosslight Pillar and the Skyreach Pillar.^Of course you not as smart as gorloc! You just simple <race>. You not without hope
column4: though! You show you can learn. Maybe crystals make you smart like crystals make us smart! I teach you to play song to clear your mind. You play song by crystals then crystals make your mind better... not as good as gorloc's but better than you have now. Lifeblood Pillar is broken
column5: but other pillars still good!

column1: Song of Fecundity^80^All^Sholazar Basin^Oracle Soo-nee^Oracle Soo-nee^^Return of the Friendly Dryskin^^Soo-nee at Rainspeaker Canopy wants you to go to the Stormwright's Shelf
column2: northwest of the Maker's Perch
column3: and play the Horn of Fecundity near 8 piles Soaked Fertile Dirt.^The storm is a destructive force. Storm burns trees. Storm floods houses. But storm can also be life force if you know right song. In Stormwright Shelf
column4: above Maker's Perch
column5: you can find small dirt mounds. They very fertile -- they carry inside a strong seed. All they wait for is the right song. You take this horn and play song for them.

column12: Plaguefist will get them out. You can still catch up to them if you hurry. The chapel is due west of here.

column1: A Special Surprise^55^Tauren^Death Knight^Knight Commander Plaguefist^Knight Commander Plaguefist^A Special Surprise^A Cry For Vengeance!^A Sort Of Homecoming^Knight Commander Plaguefist at the Chapel of the Crimson Flame has ordered you to execute Malar Bravehorn
column2: an Argent Dawn prisoner inside the nearby prison house.^We got here
column3: tore the place apart
column4: and headed toward the prison house. We weren't expecting what we found in there
column5: <name>. Seems the Crusade's been real busy. That whole thing is full of Argent Dawn prisoners. Most of them were already dead by the time we arrived
column6: but a few were still breathing. I was about to go in there and execute the rest of them
column7: but I think you should have the honors. In particular
column8: there's a real feisty tauren in there that I think you'll take great pleasure in executing.

column1: Parachutes for the Argent Crusade^76^All^Zul'Drak^Commander Falstaav^Commander Falstaav^Parachutes for the Argent Crusade^^New Orders for Sergeant Stackhammer
column2: Trouble at the Altar of Sseratus
column3: Pa'Troll^Commander Falstaav at The Argent Stand has asked you to equip 10 Argent Crusaders or Argent Shieldmen out in the courtyard with parachutes.^Those sky terrors are destroying my men and women! Dying from falling is a horrible way to go. <class>
column4: you have to get these parachutes out to them! At least then they'll have a fighting chance to survive.

column1: A Sort Of Homecoming^55^All^Death Knight^Knight Commander Plaguefist^Thassarian^A Special Surprise^^Ambush At The Overlook^Return to Thassarian at the Scarlet Tavern in New Avalon with news of your victory.^Return to Thassarian at the Scarlet Tavern and let him know that Koltira's cry for vengeance has been answered. The Chapel of the Crimson Flame will be a pile of ashes in a matter of hours. You're one cold-blooded monster
column2: <name>. I salute you
column3: <brother/sister>.

column1: Ambush At The Overlook^55^All^Death Knight^Orbaz Bloodbane^Orbaz Bloodbane^Ambush At The Overlook^A Sort Of Homecoming^^Orbaz Bloodbane at the Scarlet Tavern in New Avalon has ordered you to kill the Scarlet Courier and retrieve the Scarlet Courier's Belongings and the Scarlet Courier's Message.^While you were out burning churches and murdering vermin
column2: I've been busy formulating a plan. The Scarlet courier is scheduled to pass by the Scarlet Overlook within the hour. The roads by the overlook are wide open and swarming with Crusaders. Use this makeshift cover to hide at the overlook and wait for the Scarlet Courier to pass. When he's close enough
column3: strike with all your fury! Cut him down and take his belongings - including his clothes! The overlook is 200 paces east of here.

column1: A Meeting With Fate^55^All^Death Knight^Orbaz Bloodbane^High General Abbendis^Ambush At The Overlook^^^Orbaz Bloodbane has commanded you to deliver the Scarlet Courier's Message to High General Abbendis at King's Harbor.^This message must reach Abbendis. We do not want to draw their suspicion. They must continue under the assumption that everything is going as they planned. You will don the Scarlet courier's clothes and with the help of some dark magic
column2: take on the form of the courier. Abbendis is at King's Harbor
column3: southeast of the Scarlet Overlook. Drop off the message and get as much information out of her as you can. She will tell us what we need to know about the "Crimson Dawn."

column1: The Scarlet Onslaught Emerges^55^All^Death Knight^High General Abbendis^Orbaz Bloodbane^Ambush At The Overlook^^^Deliver The Path of Redemption to Orbaz Bloodbane at the Scarlet Tavern in New Avalon.^Listen well
column2: courier. The Scarlet lands are lost. New Avalon and Havenshire are overrun by Scourge. The specter of death looms overhead and threatens to overtake us at any moment. Return to Galvar with this message: "Turn your armies around and prepare your ships for travel to the frozen wastes. When next we meet it will be in Northrend." Give this to Galvar. <Abbendis hands you a journal.> It will explain everything. The Scarlet Crusade is no more. Long live the Scarlet Onslaught!

column1: Scarlet Armies Approach...^55^All^Death Knight^Orbaz Bloodbane^Highlord Darion Mograine^Ambush At The Overlook^^The Scarlet Apocalypse^Deliver The Path of Redemption to Highlord Darion Mograine at Acherus: The Ebon Hold.^We must prepare for the encroaching armies
column2: <name>. You will take what you have discovered to Highlord Mograine at once! I will open a portal directly to Acherus. Step inside and it will transport you. Give Highlord Mograine Abbendis' journal as well. Perhaps he'll find it useful.

column1: A Hero's Headgear^80^All^Sholazar Basin^Rejek^Rejek^^Return of the Lich Hunter^^Get Venture Co. Explosives from any of the Venture Company units at Swindlegrin's Dig and use them to obtain a Stormwatcher's Head. Bring the Stomwatcher's Head to Rejek at Frenzyheart Hill.^Rejek hears tales of giant metal men on faraway Stormwright's Shelf. Far to northwest
column2: outside basin's lip
column3: you will find it. Imagine Rejek using heads of giant metal men as helmet. Make Rejek unstoppable! Make Rejek mighty! You get for Rejek
column4: but metal head might not come off metal body easy. Maybe steal bombs from little green men and their friends at Swindlegrin's Dig near Suntouched Pillar? Use bombs to get head off metal body
column5: then bring to Rejek.

column1: Tools of War^78^All^Sholazar Basin^Vekgar^Shaman Jakjek^^Return of the Lich Hunter^^Retrieve some of Zepik's traps from his stash in Kartak's Hold. Using the traps
column2: slaughter 50 of the nearby Sparktouched Gorlocs
column3: and then return to Shaman Jakjek in Kartak's Hold.^Zepik tell me that you maybe the best gorloc hunter he met... other than Zepik. Still big battle to southwest - you go help. Zepik keeps some of biggest
column4: baddest traps in his stash at Kartak's Hold... told Vekgar to use them for battle
column5: so you use them too. Go pick out any traps you want and kill lots of big-tongues. Lots and lots!

column1: Secret Strength of the Frenzyheart^78^All^Sholazar Basin^Vekgar^Shaman Jakjek^^Return of the Lich Hunter^^Using the secret Frenzyheart drink
column2: slaughter 30 of the Sparktouched Gorlocs around Kartak's Hold.^Battle still going at Kartak hold... I think it time for you to learn big secret of Frenzyheart. We have berries we keep from other lands we came from... they not so special on their own
column3: but mix them with drunk drinks and they make Frenzyheart super strong. You a Frenzyheart now... it time you get to be strong too. I give some drink
column4: then you be super strong and you go smash all the spark big-tongues.

column1: Mastery of the Crystals^78^All^Sholazar Basin^Oracle Soo-dow^Lightningcaller Soo-met^^Return of the Friendly Dryskin^^Retrieve the crystal defenses at Sparktouched Haven and use them to kill 50 of the nearby Frenzyheart wolvar. When these tasks are complete
column2: return to Lightningcaller Soo-met in Sparktouched Haven.^Sparktouched are still being attacked by puppy-men... we think they maybe not stop if we not make them stop. We have secret weapon though... we sent it out to Soo-met so he can use to protect all Oracles. Secret weapon is from Great Ones themselves... extra shiny crystals found inside sacred Great One temples. Be very careful... no break them. Crystals are in chest near shrine at Sparktouched Haven
column3: in far southwest. You go use crystals to help Soo-met beat the puppy-men.

column1: Power of the Great Ones^78^All^Sholazar Basin^Oracle Soo-dow^Lightningcaller Soo-met^^Return of the Friendly Dryskin^^Charge the Dormant Polished Crystal at the exposed Lifeblood Pillar. Travel to Sparktouched Haven and use the power the crystal bestows to slaughter 30 of the nearby Frenzyheart wolvar
column2: and then speak to Lightningcaller Soo-met in Sparktouched Haven.^We need to do something to stop puppy-men attacking Sparktouched Haven. Jaloot brought me very special crystal that he found in River's Heart... we seen only one like it before. The crystal not have power now
column3: but the opened up lifeblood pillar should have energy to recharge it if you just bring it close. Once the crystal is charged
column4: go to Sparktouched Haven in far southwest and let the crystal's energy make you big and strong. Then it time to kick some puppy-men butt.

column1: Shifting Priorities^75^Horde^Grizzly Hills^Scout Vor'takh^Sergeant Riannah^^^^Scout Vor'takh wants you to travel to Zul'Drak and report to Sergeant Riannah at Light's Breach.^As pressing as our needs are here
column2: there's news from the lands to the north that cannot be ignored. I've just received a message from the Argent Crusade. It seems that scourge forces are gathering there and are threatening to overrun Zul'drak. Needless to say
column3: <name>
column4: if that were to happen our struggle here would be meaningless. You must go there and aid the Crusaders in beating back the Lich King's armies. Speak to Makki when you are ready to travel.

column1: Speak with your Ambassador^72^Alliance^Dragonblight^Tariolstrasz^Lauriel Trueblade^A Strange Device^^^Speak with Lauriel Trueblade at Wyrmrest Temple.^<The dragon in elf form takes your letter of introduction
column2: perusing it for a moment and then stashing it away within his sleeve.> Everything seems to be in order. However
column3: if you don't mind
column4: I would ask that you speak with your ambassador here at the temple. She has something of great import for you that needs taking care of before we send you up to the queen. <He pats at the letter under his sleeve.> I'll keep this safe for you until your return.

column1: Speak with your Ambassador^72^Horde^Dragonblight^Tariolstrasz^Golluck Rockfist^A Strange Device^^^Speak with Golluck Rockfist at Wyrmrest Temple.^<The dragon in elf form takes your letter of introduction
column2: perusing it for a moment and then stashing it away within his sleeve.> Everything seems to be in order. However
column3: if you don't mind
column4: I would ask that you speak with your ambassador here at the temple. He has something of great import for you that needs taking care of before we send you up to the queen. <He pats at the letter under his sleeve.> I'll keep this safe for you until your return.

column1: The Steward of Wyrmrest Temple^75^Alliance^Dragonblight^Ceristrasz^Tariolstrasz^A Strange Device^^^Speak with Tariolstrasz at Wyrmrest Temple.^You've proved that you're to be trusted and more. You should return to Wyrmrest Temple and speak with the steward
column2: Tariolstrasz
column3: once more
column4: <name>.

column1: The Steward of Wyrmrest Temple^75^Horde^Dragonblight^Vargastrasz^Tariolstrasz^A Strange Device^^^Speak with Tariolstrasz at Wyrmrest Temple.^You've proved that you're to be trusted and more. You should return to Wyrmrest Temple and speak with the steward
column2: Tariolstrasz
column3: once more
column4: <name>.

column1: Reallocating Resources^75^Alliance^Grizzly Hills^Captain Gryan Stoutmantle^Sergeant Riannah^^^^Gryan Stoutmantle wants you to report to Sergeant Riannah at Light's Breach in Zul'Drak.^Listen up
column2: <class>! Your days here are numbered. As much as we need capable <class>s in our ranks
column3: there's trouble up north that makes our problems look like a mid-summer Stormwind parade. Turns out the Scourge are concentrating their efforts - making a big push to take over Zul'Drak. If that happens
column4: we may as well pack it in. You're free to finish any business here
column5: but then it's off to Light's Breach with you. Speak to Samuel if you need transportation. Dismissed.

column1: The Scarlet Apocalypse^55^All^Death Knight^Highlord Darion Mograine^The Lich King^The Scarlet Apocalypse^Scarlet Armies Approach...^^Seek out the Lich King at Death's Breach.^The trap has been sprung
column2: death knight. The armies of Hearthglen and Tirisfal have arrived
column3: just in time to see their enclave in flames! If they turn back now
column4: they fight us with their backs turned. <Mograine shakes his head.> No
column5: they have only one option
column6: which has only one outcome: APOCALYPSE! As we speak
column7: they prepare to make one final stand. The Lich King awaits your return
column8: champion. He stands watch below us
column9: at Death's Breach.

column1: An End To All Things...^55^All^Death Knight^The Lich King^The Lich King^The Scarlet Apocalypse^^^The Lich King has commanded you to eradicate the Scarlet Crusade.^You have slaughtered legions beyond number and still your dark heart craves more. Your hunger knows no end
column2: <name>. <The Lich King pauses.> There must come an end to all things
column3: death knight. The Scarlet armies make their final stand against us. For them
column4: there is no escape... no choice. And for this reason they will fight with a ferocity that you have yet to witness. Use this horn to call forth one of my wyrms. Climb upon its back and command it into battle. With it you will end the Scarlet Crusade.

column1: Into the Breach!^75^All^Zul'Drak^Crusader Valus^Sergeant Riannah^^The Cleansing Of Jintha'kalar^^Crusader Valus at Light's Trust wants you to report to Sergeant Riannah at Light's Breach in Zul'Drak.^Ready yourself
column2: <class>. I'm dispatching you to Light's Breach
column3: northeast of here. I've received word that the Scourge are making a push to take over Zul'Drak. <Valus stares you dead in the eyes.> This will not come to pass. See to it that you assist in the destruction of the Scourge there. The light demands it. Dismissed.

column1: Learning to Leave and Return: the Magical Way^74^All^Dalaran^Archmage Celindra^Archmage Celindra^The Magical Kingdom of Dalaran^^^Archmage Celindra at The Violet Gate in Dalaran wants you to use the Teleport to Violet Stand Crystal and the Teleport to Dalaran Crystal.^Just in case you don't already know
column2: you can use the crystal on the platform behind me to teleport to the Violet Stand in Crystalsong Forest beneath Dalaran. Correspondingly
column3: you can use the crystal at the stand below to return to the chamber above me. I would like for you to do this now.

column1: The Magical Kingdom of Dalaran^74^Horde^Dalaran^Image of Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^Archmage Celindra^The Magical Kingdom of Dalaran^^^Deliver the Kirin Tor Signet to Archmage Celindra at The Violet Gate in Dalaran.^Hello
column2: <name>. You may or may not be aware that we Kirin Tor moved our city here to Northrend. No longer does Dalaran sit under its protective dome on the shores of Lordamere Lake. Now the city magically floats above the Crystalsong Forest. We believe you to be ready for your journey to the city. Speak with me again and I will cast a spell of teleportation to transport you there. When you arrive
column3: seek out Archmage Celindra and give her my signet as proof that we spoke.

column1: First Things First^75^All^Zul'Drak^Commander Kunz^Sergeant Riannah^^^^Commander Kunz at Argent Stand wants you to report to Sergeant Riannah at Light's Breach.^Listen up
column2: <race>! This entire region is full of crises. Everywhere you look you'll find those who could use your assistance. <Kunz looks you squarely in the eye.> No one needs your help right now more than Riannah. The scourge have forced their way between us
column3: leaving her and those she commands isolated. Light's Breach
column4: where her forces are holding out
column5: lies just southwest of here.

column1: Smoke on the Horizon^75^All^Zul'Drak^Witch Doctor Khufu^Sergeant Riannah^^^^Khufu in Zim'Torga wants you to travel to Light's Breach and report to Sergeant Riannah there.^You hear that
column2: <race>? The clamor of battle far to the west reaches us here
column3: even over the din of our own struggle. The Scourge are threatening to break through the lines of those calling themselves the Argent Crusade. Preventing this is as urgent as anything in the region. Travel to Light's Breach and join in their struggle. Speak to Maaka and he will provide you safe passage.

column1: The Magical Kingdom of Dalaran^74^Alliance^Dalaran^Baron Ulrik von Stromhearth^Archmage Celindra^The Magical Kingdom of Dalaran^^^Deliver the Kirin Tor Signet to Archmage Celindra at the Violet Gate in Dalaran.^Hello
column2: <name>. You may or may not be aware that we Kirin Tor moved our city here to Northrend. No longer does Dalaran sit under its protective dome on the shores of Lordamere Lake. Now the city magically floats above the Crystalsong Forest. We believe you to be ready for your journey to the city. Speak with me again and I will cast a spell of teleportation to transport you there. When you arrive
column3: seek out Archmage Celindra and give her my signet as proof that we spoke.

column1: Taking a Stand^75^All^Zul'Drak^Bloodrose Datura^Commander Falstaav^Taking a Stand^Kickin' Nass and Takin' Manes^^Bloodrose Datura at Ebon Watch wants you to speak with Commander Falstaav at The Argent Stand.^A few moments ago I spotted a signal flare over the treeline to the east. That can only mean that things are not going smoothly for the Crusaders at Argent Stand. I cannot leave our post here
column2: <race>
column3: but you can. When time permits
column4: make your way up to Commander Falstaav and see if there's anything you can do to lighten their burden.

column1: The Magical Kingdom of Dalaran^74^All^Dalaran^Magister Teronus III^Archmage Celindra^The Magical Kingdom of Dalaran^^^Deliver the Kirin Tor Signet to Archmage Celindra at The Violet Gate in Dalaran.^Hello
column2: <name>. You may or may not be aware that we Kirin Tor moved our city here to Northrend. No longer does Dalaran sit under its protective dome on the shores of Lordamere Lake. Now the city magically floats above the Crystalsong Forest. We believe you to be ready for your journey to the city. Speak with me again and I will cast a spell of teleportation to transport you there. When you arrive
column3: seek out Archmage Celindra and give her my signet as proof that we spoke.

column1: Back Through the Waygate^78^All^Sholazar Basin^The Etymidian^Avatar of Freya^The Lifewarden's Wrath^^^Bring the Omega Rune to the Avatar of Freya at the Rainspeaker Rapids in Sholazar Basin.^You speak the truth
column2: <race>. I can sense the very essence of Sholazar Basin begin to fray by the blight of undeath even as we speak. I've bound my being into the rune
column3: <race>. Deliver it to she who sent you here -- for only her power can grant me passage to her lands.

column1: Siphoning the Spirits^75^All^Zul'Drak^Captain Arnath^Captain Arnath^^^Stocking the Shelves
column2: Clipping Their Wings^Captain Arnath at Heb'Valok wants you to collect 5 Ancient Ectoplasms from the Lost Drakkari Spirits at the Pools of Zha'Jin.^You should be happy he's coming
column3: they said. You'll enjoy his company
column4: they said.... Well it's not as if I had a choice in the matter. Finklestein is the Crusade's best alchemist. I suppose I should be honored that he's chosen my post to set up shop. But ever since he's arrived
column5: I've been relegated to collecting various alchemical ingredients. Say
column6: <race>
column7: how about you give me a hand? Just south of here are some pools that are haunted by spirits of ancient trolls. Collect their ectoplasm for me.

column1: The Lich King's Command^55^All^Death Knight^The Lich King^Scourge Commander Thalanor^The Scarlet Apocalypse^^The Light of Dawn^Report to Scourge Commander Thalanor at Browman Mill.^The Scarlet Enclave is no more. What remains of the Crusade will be dealt with in Northrend. We now turn all of our efforts to Light's Hope Chapel. No longer will this affront to your master be allowed to exist! I have issued my final command. Scourge Commander Thalanor awaits your arrival at the edge of Browman Mill. Go northwest
column2: through the cave
column3: into the Noxious Glade and take the path leading out of the glade to the mill. Do not fail me
column4: <name>.

column1: The Light of Dawn^55^All^Death Knight^Scourge Commander Thalanor^Highlord Darion Mograine^The Light of Dawn^The Lich King's Command^^Defeat the forces of the Argent Dawn and uncover the Light of Dawn.^The Argent Dawn stands defiantly against us at Light's Hope Chapel. They dare oppose the Scourge and for that reason alone they must be destroyed! The mighty armies of the Lich King stand at the ready as the final battle for the Plaguelands approaches. Today we ascend into the immortal realm of Scourge heroes! When you are ready for battle
column2: report to Highlord Darion Mograine. It is the highlord who will issue the final march orders and command our armies at Light's Hope Chapel.

column1: My Heart is in Your Hands^74^All^Grizzly Hills^Heart of the Ancients^Image of Drakuru^Good Troll Hunting^^^Drakuru wants you to bring the Heart of the Ancients to him at Drak'atal Passage.^<Drakuru's voice fills your mind.> Hey
column2: mon! Dis eye of da prophets be great! I been usin' it to watch ya and I see ya got da heart now! Not bad.... Now ya just gotta bring it to my brazier at Drak'atal Passage
column3: a short walk east of ya. Ya must drink my elixir at da pedestal to summon me there. This time
column4: ya need ta mix in some desperate mojo from the defenders there for it ta be workin'.

column1: Force of Nature^78^All^Sholazar Basin^Pilot Vic^Avatar of Freya^Force of Nature^^^Travel to the Blight Line
column2: between Rainspeaker Rapids and the Lost Lands in Sholazar Basin and seek the Avatar of Freya.^I'm not sure about what I saw while flying to the northeast
column3: but to me it looked like a gigantic woman kicking some Scourge butt. I'd heard the professor talk about a certain "lifewarden" appointed by the titans to look over Sholazar. I might not be a titan historian
column4: but it sounds like she fits the bill. I also know that if the Scourge cross the border between the Lost Lands and the rest of Sholazar
column5: our expedition's as good as dead. What do you say you go look for her and lend a hand?

column1: A Steak Fit for a Hunter^76^All^Sholazar Basin^Korg the Cleaver^Korg the Cleaver^^^^Bring 5 Longneck Grazer Steaks to Korg the Cleaver at the Nesingwary Base Camp.^Sometimes
column2: there's nothing worse than a camp full of hunters. They're all so busy taking down prey animals that the only meat I get is tough and stringy. That's hardly the kind of thing you want to come home to after a long day on the hunt. Lucky for us
column3: though
column4: there is a source of tender
column5: succulent meat nearby. To the south of the river and the camp live longneck grazers. They're a perfect source of meat for our hungry hunters. Bring me back the best cuts of meat and we'll properly toast our comrades.

column1: Salvaging Life's Strength^77^All^Sholazar Basin^Avatar of Freya^Avatar of Freya^^The Fallen Pillar^^The Avatar of Freya wants you to go to the Sundered Shard to the southeast and use the Lifeforce Gem on 8 destroyed Lifeblood Elementals.^The Lifeblood Pillar was toppled over with great force
column2: sending the very earth into an upheaval. The elementals that wander the sundered shard carry with them the very life essence that gave the pillar its strength. I cannot allow this energy to be wasted
column3: for only four pillars remain. Head to the sundered shard
column4: to the southeast
column5: and seek the lifeblood elementals. Use this gem on their remains to recover their rampant energy. We'll need the energy to heal the land when all this is over.

column1: To the Rise with all Due Haste!^80^All^Icecrown^Baron Sliver^Lord-Commander Arete^To the Rise with all Due Haste!^^^Report to Lord-Commander Arete at Death's Rise in Icecrown.^Some would say that our most critical mission lies not with the Lich King
column2: but with the utter destruction of the Scarlet Onslaught. I would say that is foolish
column3: but who am I to judge? Death's Rise is far to the southwest
column4: overlooking the sea along the cliff wall. There you will find Lord-Commander Arete personally overseeing the Onslaught's destruction himself. <The baron clears his throat.> Do see to it that you report to him with all due haste. He asked for you personally.

column1: The Story Thus Far...^80^All^Icecrown^Lord-Commander Arete^Lord-Commander Arete^To the Rise with all Due Haste!^^From Their Corpses
column2: Rise!
column3: Intelligence Gathering^Listen to Lord-Commander Arete's tale at Death's Rise.^We have much to do
column4: but first I believe a short refresher is in order. We death knights have a colorful past with our Scarlet friends who idiotically rest comfortably in the harbor below us to the northwest. When you are ready for an earful
column5: speak with me again and I shall provide enlightenment.

column1: Blood in the Water^80^All^Icecrown^Lord-Commander Arete^Lord-Commander Arete^To the Rise with all Due Haste!^^^Lord-Commander Arete at Death's Rise wants you to fill the Gore Bladder with the blood of 10 Ravenous Jaws.^The forces at Onslaught Harbor are heavily reinforced by gryphon riders. You need a mount that will enable you to put them down. But first
column2: we need the components for the ritual that is going to make it all happen. A great deal of blood is necessary for the ritual to be undertaken. <The lord-commander points down and to the northwest.> There is a readily available supply down there in the harbor... sharks. Do not return to me until you've filled this bladder with their blood.

column1: From Their Corpses
column2: Rise!^80^All^Icecrown^Setaal Darkmender^Setaal Darkmender^^The Story Thus Far...^^Setaal Darkmender at Death's Rise has given you the Darkmender's Tincture. Apply it to the corpses of 10 of any of the Scarlet Onslaught units found at Onslaught Harbor.^How kind... how generous our lord-commander is. Where he is flowers and sunshine
column3: I am filled only with hatred. It is not enough to end their miserable lives... I want them humiliated... debased! What could be more unspeakable than to be turned into that which you hate? To dedicate your existence to eradicating a thing
column4: and then in the end to become it? How sad. Take this tincture northwest to Onslaught Harbor. Apply it to their still corpses and watch what happens
column5: but avoid the cathedral.

column1: You'll Need a Gryphon^80^All^Icecrown^Lord-Commander Arete^Uzo Deathcaller^To the Rise with all Due Haste!^^No Fly Zone^Deliver an Onslaught Gryphon to Uzo Deathcaller at Death's Rise.^What could be more fitting than to take one of their own gryphons to use against them? Go to Onslaught Harbor and take the reins to one of their gryphons from the dead clutches of its rider. Return with the gryphon
column2: delivering it to Uzo Deathcaller. He will see to its proper transformation and provide you with further instructions.

column1: No Fly Zone^80^All^Icecrown^Uzo Deathcaller^Uzo Deathcaller^^You'll Need a Gryphon^^Uzo Deathcaller at Death's Rise wants you to kill 10 Onslaught Gryphon Riders.^Now that you got your bone gryphon
column2: I wantcha to take it back down there everyday and make a no fly zone over Onslaught Harbor. I gotta admit
column3: mon
column4: I don't really care if you use the bone gryphon to kill them gryphon riders or not. But I'm guessin' that if you do
column5: you'll find it much easier to get to 'em. Besides
column6: it's got lots of neat tricks you can use.

column1: Investigate the Scourge of Silvermoon^10^Horde^Scourge Invasion^Lieutenant Julek^Lieutenant Julek^^^^Collect three Dim Necrotic Stones from the Scourge outside Silvermoon and investigate the glowing runic circles near their encampment.^The Lich King has sent his undead upon our very doorstep; we cannot remain idle! Surely you will step up to defend Silvermoon from these accursed invaders? There are strange runic circles outside
column2: glowing with the same energy that surrounds the undead and the Necropolis above. They have significance
column3: I'm certain
column4: and I want you to find out what. Thin the numbers of those aberrations while you're at it; bring me proof of their death along with your results
column5: and I will reward you. Go!

column1: Investigate the Scourge of Exodar^10^Alliance^Scourge Invasion^Lieutenant Kregor^Lieutenant Kregor^^^^Collect three Dim Necrotic Stones from the Scourge outside the Exodar and investigate the glowing runic circles near their encampment. Then return to Lieutenant Kregor.^The Lich King has sent his undead upon our very doorstep; we cannot remain idle! Surely you will step up to defend the Exodar from these accursed invaders? There are strange runic circles outside
column2: glowing with the same energy that surrounds the undead and the Necropolis above. They have significance
column3: I'm certain
column4: and I want you to find out what. Thin the numbers of those aberrations while you're at it; bring me proof of their death along with your results
column5: and I will reward you. Go!

column1: Clean Up^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Jeer Sparksocket^Jeer Sparksocket^Clean Up^^^Jeer Sparksocket at K3 would like 10 pieces of Charred Wreckage.^To the point... Ricket's asked me to put together some stronger land mines
column2: but I'm running low on parts. Just west of town
column3: you'll find the remains of our last rocket sled... Ricket got a little excited when she was fueling it
column4: but I probably should have thought to not put the nozzle right over the exhaust. Live and learn
column5: eh? There should be a good stock of spare parts scattered around the destroyed sled... why don't you go ahead and chase off those scavengers and nab me some of that wreckage?

column1: Just Around the Corner^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Jeer Sparksocket^Jeer Sparksocket^Clean Up^^^Jeer Sparksocket at K3 would like Sparksocket's Tools retrieved from his minefield.^Blast it! Where are my tools? I had them here just a moment ago. Oh! I probably forgot them when I was setting up that minefield in the west. That's mildly inconvenient. I'd be quite appreciative if you could go get them for me. You'll need to watch your step though... you should be able to use the same path that I did to get out. Oh
column2: and don't try to fly in... I had the presence of mind to set up turrets to shoot down anything that might fly
column3: and they aren't very discerning in who they target.

column1: A Delicate Touch^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Ricket^Ricket^Clean Up^^^Ricket at K3 wants you to use Improved Land Mines at Garm's Bane to fend off 12 attackers from Garm. Both Garm Invaders and Snowblind Followers will count towards this goal.^I've been waiting an eternity for these mines! Well
column2: a few days at least. What took him so long? Here's the low down
column3: compadre... there's this nasty bunch of magnataur--you know
column4: big
column5: hairy
column6: and extremely ugly--and they seem pretty keen on taking K3 for themselves. Not going to happen. We've got some defenses set up in their path
column7: northeast of here. Sadly
column8: our laser turrets have pretty limited power supplies... that's where these mines come in! Get over there and blow them up good!

column1: Opening the Backdoor^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Ricket^Ricket^Opening the Backdoor^Ample Inspiration^^Ricket at K3 would like you to locate the Transporter Power Cell and use it to activate the Transportation Pad at Garm's Rise.^The sapper squad is ready. That means it's fun time
column2: my dear! There's only one thing holding us up from our full-scale assault on Garm! I sent a runner to set a teleporter up behind Garm--successfully I might add--and he returned to get the power cell it needs to function. It isn't working yet... which means the power cell didn't get there. I need you to look just on the other side of Garm's Bane for the power cell. When you find it
column3: bring it farther east to Garm's Rise and activate the teleporter.

column1: Know No Fear^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Ricket^Ricket^Opening the Backdoor^^^Ricket at K3 wants you to kill 6 Garm Watchers and 8 Snowblind Devotees.^Now that we have the teleporter open
column2: my plan is quite complex... it has several facets and will take impeccable coordination. And there are supplies to be gathered! And troops to recruit! Likely
column3: weeks of hard labor as well! Hahah
column4: I had you going there for a moment
column5: didn't I? You've got this
column6: kid. Hop through the teleporter and take the fight to them! Our sappers will back you up... they won't have anywhere to run.

column1: A Flawless Plan^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Gino^Gino^A Flawless Plan^^^Gino at Garm's Rise wants you to plant the Hardpacked Explosive Bundle near Frostgut's Altar
column2: kill Tormar Frostgut
column3: and then escape the cave before it collapses on you.^Hey there! Joining us for the assault I assume? I've got a special task for you... we're going to bring the whole cave down on their heads! Towards the back of their cave
column4: you should find Frostgut's Altar. Sneak up and plant this hardpacked explosive bundle somewhere close to it. Once the charge is placed
column5: stick around just long enough to make sure Frostgut bites it
column6: then get out quickly! There's no knowing how long the cave will last once that thing goes off!

column1: Demolitionist Extraordinaire^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Gino^Ricket^A Flawless Plan^^Overstock
column2: When All Else Fails
column3: When All Else Fails^Return to Ricket at K3.^You've got some swift feet on you sonny! Thanks for lending a hand with those explosives... I've been waiting to give that invention a good test run for a while! Go ahead and tell Ricket we should be covered on the magnataur front now... my sappers will clean up any of the remaining baddies. Thanks again!

column1: Slightly Unstable^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Jeer Sparksocket^Ricket^Clean Up^^^Deliver Jeer's Improved Land Mines to Ricket in K3.^Looking good! No
column2: not you - my new mines. You're just a little full of yourself
column3: aren't you? I
column4: on the other hand
column5: am absolutely brilliant! My intellect cannot be matched. What were we talking about? Oh yes
column6: my new mines! New and improved... ready for whatever devious use Ricket has concocted. Be a <good lad/doll> and go hand them off to Ricket
column7: will you? She's right over there... it should be quite the epic journey
column8: I'm sure. Be careful though
column9: she's a little loopy.

column1: Reclaimed Rations^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Ricket^Ricket^^^^Ricket at K3 wants you to repossess 16 Dried Gnoll Rations from the nearby Savage Hill Gnolls.^Hey hey! You're a new face! Care to lend Ricket a hand? We have a somewhat unexpected problem - food shortage. I know
column2: I know... we should have seen that coming
column3: but you don't get it. We tend to have somewhat of a quick turn-around here with our sapper squad and all
column4: so usually we don't have to worry about long term eats. Good old K3's gotten popular though. Convenient solution? There are gnoll camps to the west and some gnolls scattered
column5: scavenging as gnolls do. Care to go nab some of their rations?

column1: Ample Inspiration^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Ricket^Ricket^^Expression of Gratitude^Opening the Backdoor^Ricket at K3 wants you to retrieve a U.D.E.D
column2: use it to blow up a mammoth
column3: and retrieve 8 Hearty Mammoth Meat.^Wow! That stuff is nasty. Not to account for gnoll taste or anything
column4: but I figured whatever they had would at least be... edible? Let's get more creative. Tore's got an explosive dispenser north of town... not far from the big cavern entrance
column5: can't miss it. I'm sure she intends them for mining purposes of some sort
column6: but I've got a better idea. Grab one of those things and rush it to one of the nearby mammoths... most of them are to the west. Collect the meat
column7: bring it back.

column1: Moving In^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Tore Rumblewrench^Tore Rumblewrench^^^^Tore Rumblewrench outside of Crystalweb Cavern wants you to kill 12 Crystalweb Spiders.^Hiya! The name's Tore. I head up the mining operation here at K3... or I will shortly anyway! This here cave is full of creepy-crawlies. I think we could do with a few less spiders before we move in - what'd you think?

Ore Repossession^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Tore Rumblewrench^Tore Rumblewrench^^^^Tore Rumblewrench outside of Crystalweb Cavern would like you to retrieve 5 samples of Impure Saronite Ore.^We're moving in! There were some snobolds here when we arrived... their mining operation seems to have met some unfortunate happenings though. Doesn't much matter - we were taking over soon anyway. I sent some of our miners in there to get me some ore samples that I can use to calibrate our machines for processing
column2: but they haven't come back. Mind going in there and nabbing some samples for me in their stead? The snobolds probably have some on them
column3: though I'd expect most of them are dead by now.

column1: Only Partly Forgotten^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Injured Goblin Miner^Injured Goblin Miner^Only Partly Forgotten^^^An Injured Goblin Miner in Crystalweb Cavern wants you to bring back an Icetip Venom Sac from an Icetip Crawler.^Oi... it's like there's a propeller in my stomach. I think I can walk
column2: but I got something nasty in my system when I got bit by something in the back of the cave. It was bigger than the other spiders... and brightly colored. Ricket can probably make me an antidote
column3: but she'd need the venom sac from whatever bit me. Would you mind finding it for me? I don't think Tore's coming. I'll just pretend I'm dead here and hopefully they'll leave me alone.

column1: Bitter Departure^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Injured Goblin Miner^Ricket^Only Partly Forgotten^^^Escort the Injured Goblin Miner out of Crystalweb Cavern and then speak to Ricket at K3.^Oi - thank you! I thought for sure I'd just be a spider snack. Perhaps I'm speaking a bit soon though - let's get the heck out of here! Let me know as soon as you're ready to go... make it quick.

Overstock^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Ricket^Ricket^^Demolitionist Extraordinaire^^Ricket at K3 wants you to use Improved Land Mines at Garm's Bane to fend off the attackers from Garm. Both Garm Invaders and Snowblind Followers will count towards this goal.^Hey there again! You didn't run off like all the other adventurers did? Well
column2: you're just a peach
column3: aren't ya? I was beginning to think I smelled funny or something! We could still use a bit of a hand around here
column4: and you have just the right experience. Remember those magnataur? Well apparently the cave didn't completely collapse... there are still quite a few left. So much for Gino taking care of them
column5: eh? Fortunately
column6: Jeer made way more than enough mines. You've got this!

column1: Expression of Gratitude^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Ricket^Ricket^^^Ample Inspiration^Ricket at K3 wants you to kill Gnarlhide.^I know just the job for an eager newcomer! We've got a gnoll problem. You might even call it a gnoll infestation! Pesky things. They keep creeping up more and more
column2: and now they're on our doorstep
column3: stealing our parts! Inconceivable. It all begins and ends with their uppity leader
column4: Gnarlhide. I want you to see to that "ends" part. Go pay him a visit at his camp all the way to the west
column5: in Snowblind Hills. And when I say "pay him a visit
column6: that's a euphemism for kill him painfully." Kay? Kay!

column1: Intelligence Gathering^80^All^Icecrown^Aurochs Grimbane^Aurochs Grimbane^^The Story Thus Far...^^Aurochs Grimbane at Death's Rise wants you to collect 5 Onslaught Intel Documents.^I need to know what the Scarlet Onslaught is planning today. You will be my instrument in this task. Fly to Onslaught Harbor and rifle through their baggage trunks for documents. The trunks will be locked
column2: so you'll have to take the keys from the Scarlet Onslaught members by whatever means.

column1: The Grand (Admiral's) Plan^80^All^Icecrown^Note from the Grand Admiral^Lord-Commander Arete^The Grand (Admiral's) Plan^^^Deliver the Note from the Grand Admiral to Lord-Commander Arete at Death's Rise.^At first this note looks like any of the other intel that you've been looking for. However
column2: a quick perusal of its contents disabuses you of this notion. The letter conveys that Grand Admiral Westwind is present somewhere on the island
column3: but that he is keeping himself secluded for now. He speaks of a glorious day that is coming soon in which the Scarlet Onslaught will wash over first the Lich King and then the rest of world to finally bring order to Azeroth. The lord-commander will want to see this!

column1: In Strict Confidence^80^All^Icecrown^Lord-Commander Arete^Lord-Commander Arete^The Grand (Admiral's) Plan^^^Lord-Commander Arete at Death's Rise wants you to beat information out of Captains Welsington and Hartford.^If anyone knows where the admiral is
column2: then surely it must be his captains on the ships in Onslaught Harbor. <The lord-commander rubs his hands together.> Welsington and Hartford are their names if memory serves. Go beat the information out of them and then end their miserable lives. I want to know where the grand admiral is hidden!

column1: The Crone's Bargain^79^All^The Storm Peaks^Lok'lira the Crone^Lok'lira the Crone^They Took Our Men!^^^Lok'lira the Crone inside the Forlorn Mine wants you to retrieve the Runes of the Yrkvinn from Overseer Syra.^Yes
column2: it must be the green-skinned prisoner you're after... We might be able to help each other. You're not going to get the goblin out of here by force. Not alive
column3: anyway. Among my people I am known as a Yrkvinn
column4: a practitioner of illusions. As you can see
column5: the Hyldnir have made me their prisoner. If I had my runes
column6: I could make you go unnoticed among them. Further inside
column7: patrolling the mines
column8: you'll find an overseer named Syra. She has my runes. Retrieve them and we'll talk some more.

column1: Runeforging: Preparation For Battle^55^All^Death Knight^Instructor Razuvious^Instructor Razuvious^In Service Of The Lich King^^^Instructor Razuvious in Ebon Hold has commanded you to use your Runeforging ability to engrave a rune [of your choosing] upon your Runed Soulblade.^The mark of war is etched indelibly upon your soul
column2: death knight. You have learned the dark art of runeforging and with it you will engrave runes of power upon your weaponry. Preparations for battle must be made. Return to one of the runeforges
column3: here in the Heart of Acherus
column4: and use the power of runeforging to emblazon your weapon with a rune of power! Return to me when your blade glows with dark energy!

column1: They Took Our Men!^79^All^The Storm Peaks^Gretchen Fizzlespark^Gretchen Fizzlespark^They Took Our Men!^^^Gretchen Fizzlespark wants you to go to Sifreldar Village and rescue 5 Goblin Prisoners.^You have to help us! We were in the middle of an expedition into the mountains to set up a transmission tower when we were attacked. They looked like vrykul
column2: except their skin was blue and layered with frost.... and they were all female! They took all the men in the expedition and let us women go. Please
column3: <name>! We think they're being held in Sifreldar
column4: the village overlooking K3.

column1: Equipment Recovery^79^All^The Storm Peaks^Gretchen Fizzlespark^Gretchen Fizzlespark^^^^Gretchen Fizzlespark wants you to obtain 8 pieces of K3 Equipment in Sifreldar Village north of K3.^Please
column2: <name>. When the Hyldnir took our men
column3: they also took all our equipment. Of course
column4: it's more important that we get our boys back
column5: but if you run into any of our equipment
column6: I'd really appreciate it if you brought it back to us. You'll find their village just above us
column7: to the north.

column1: Leave No Goblin Behind^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Gretchen Fizzlespark^Lok'lira the Crone^They Took Our Men!^^^Find the entrance to the Forlorn Mine in northern Sifreldar Village and look for clues for Zeev Fizzlespark's whereabouts.^All of our boys are back... thanks to you
column2: <name>! Well... all but one. My brother Zeev is still up there according to the others. Apparently they have some sort of mine where they make their prisoners work. Go in there and see if you can find out anything.

column1: Second Chances^80^All^Icecrown^Lord-Commander Arete^Lord-Commander Arete^The Grand (Admiral's) Plan^^^Kill Archbishop Landgren and then summon Arete's Gate in the presence of his corpse. Speak with Lord-Commander Arete inside The Crimson Cathedral once he's completed his questioning of the archbishop's spirit.^I'd heard they have an archbishop in their cathedral
column2: but I had no idea that they'd resurrected and promoted Landgren! The Crimson Cathedral is heavily guarded with only one entrance
column3: so you'll need help. We still need to know where the grand admiral is
column4: but this time we're not taking any chances! Take this device. It can be used to summon a gate for me to step through once you've killed the archbishop. I'll have my answers directly from his compelled soul! We will find Grand Admiral Westwind!

column1: The Endless Hunger^55^All^Death Knight^Instructor Razuvious^Instructor Razuvious^In Service Of The Lich King^^^Instructor Razuvious in Ebon Hold has commanded you to free an Unworthy Initiate and then kill the Unworthy Initiate in cold blood!^The endless hunger will soon take hold of you
column2: <class>. When it does
column3: you will feel pain immeasurable. There is only one remedy for the suffering: the hunger must be sated. I give you the key to your salvation. Chained to the Heart of Acherus are those deemed unworthy of the dark brotherhood. Use the key to free an unworthy initiate. Allow them to equip their gear and battle you for their freedom. Kill and the pain will cease. Fail and suffer for eternity. Live or die - the choice is yours to make.

column1: Report To Scourge Commander Thalanor^55^All^Death Knight^Highlord Darion Mograine^Scourge Commander Thalanor^In Service Of The Lich King^^^Report to Scourge Commander Thalanor at the balcony on the first floor of Ebon Hold.^Scourge Commander Thalanor awaits your arrival at the overhang located directly southeast of our current position. Report to Thalanor and requisition a Scourge gryphon to deliver you to Death's Breach. Prince Valanar will be waiting for you down below. Suffer well
column2: <brother/sister>!

column1: Going Bearback^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Brijana^Brijana^They Took Our Men!^^^Brijana at Brunnhildar Village wants you to mount Icefang and shoot 7 Frostworgs and 15 Frost Giants in the Valley of Ancient Winters.^The test awaits
column2: woman! Do you have the heart of a warrior queen? Or that of a sniveling seamstress? One taste of war and you'll know the answer. You might lie to your mother
column3: your sisters
column4: and even yourself
column5: but the battlefield always exposes one's true nature. When you've made your preparations
column6: mount Icefang and ride into battle. From her back
column7: you must rain down a shower of death upon our enemy.

column1: The Admiral Revealed^80^All^Icecrown^Lord-Commander Arete^Lord-Commander Arete^The Grand (Admiral's) Plan^^^Lord-Commander Arete wants you to deal with Grand Admiral Westwind. Return to the lord-commander upon Death's Rise after you have done so.^When High General Abbendis was confronted at New Hearthglen
column2: the grand admiral protected himself within an impenetrable sphere of magic before making his escape. I am particularly adept at nullifying magic. Take this to use against him inside The Hidden Hollow when he puts the sphere up. I wish that I could be there to see the look on his face when you do it. Deal with him.

column1: Luxurious Getaway!^78^All^The Storm Peaks^Rin Duoctane^Jeer Sparksocket^^^^Speak to Jeer Sparksocket at K3 in the Storm Peaks.^Hey there
column2: pal! Do you like excitement and explosions?! Who doesn't? I know just the place for you. Down at luxurious K3
column3: they're always making innovative inventions and finding all-new ways to make things blow up! Sounds thrilling
column4: doesn't it? If you want to be part of the fun
column5: head on down today and speak to Jeer Sparksocket! Mandatory disclaimer: manual labor may be required to partake in previously indicated "excitement."

column1: On Brann's Trail^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Archaeologist Andorin^Archaeologist Andorin^^^^Retrieve the Burlap-Wrapped Note from Brann's camp and return it to Archaeologist Andorin at Frosthold.^After the discovery of Brann's journal in Grizzly Hills
column2: we've only had one other communication from Brann. A mysterious note found its way to Explorers' League headquarters in Ironforge
column3: with no indication of where it came from. All it said was that we're to meet Brann at his camp and help him with his search. From what I can tell
column4: the camp should be located northeast of here
column5: across the Bor's Breath River and at the foot of some ruins from the Path of the Titans.

column1: Sniffing Out the Perpetrator^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Archaeologist Andorin^Brann Bronzebeard^Sniffing Out the Perpetrator^^^Use the Frosthound Collar at the Abandoned Camp to track down whoever took Brann's possessions. When you recover them
column2: use the communication device and speak to whoever you can contact.^The tone of Brann's note suggests he meant to bury something with the note
column3: maybe a pack of some kind. You're sure this was all you found? Okay
column4: I'm going to have you take one of these frosthounds with you. The frostborn use them for tracking. Bring it to the destroyed camp and let it get Brann's scent. It should at least lead you to the location of those missing possessions
column5: and if we're lucky
column6: Brann himself.

column1: Cold Hearted^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Brijana^Brijana^They Took Our Men!^^^Brijana
column2: just east of Brunnhildar Village
column3: wants you to fly to Dun Niffelem
column4: then free 3 Captured Proto-Drakes and rescue 9 Brunnhildar Prisoners.^To be slain honorably on the field of battle brings us all glory. To be frozen in a block of ice and endlessly taunted does not.... You are to fly to the frost giant city of Dun Niffelem
column5: just east of the Valley of Ancient Winters
column6: and liberate a captive proto-drake. With her
column7: you will be able to free our sisters from their frozen bonds and carry three of them safely home. Beware the giants' clubs
column8: sister
column9: lest you find yourself numbered among the captives.

column1: Wanted: Ragemane's Flipper^75^All^Zul'Drak^Wanted!^Chief Rageclaw^^^^Recover Ragemane's Flipper and return it to Chief Rageclaw at Light's Breach in Zul'Drak.^Posted by Chief Rageclaw: Chief Rageclaw trusty lion seal
column2: Ragemane
