column3: bite hand that feed him. Rageclaw say Ragemane no more good because of bad Drakuru trolls. Chief Rageclaw very sad to ask that Ragemane be killeded and Ragemane flipper be returned to chief as proof. You find Ragemane to southeast
column4: at Rageclaw Lake. Chief Rageclaw sorry for bad writing. First time use one of these things; plus
column5: Chief Rageclaw is wolvar
column6: not person.

column1: Pieces to the Puzzle^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Brann Bronzebeard^Brann Bronzebeard^Sniffing Out the Perpetrator^^^Gather 6 Inventor's Disk Fragments and use them to assemble the Inventor's Disk.^Thank the Light that someone got my message. Now that I'm safe from the iron dwarves
column2: I need to ask your help with something. I've got a lead on Norgannon's keystone
column3: which guards access to Ulduar's archives
column4: but the Titans divided it into two pieces and secreted them away. One of the pieces
column5: the keystone's shell
column6: is held within the Inventor's Library on the northern coast
column7: south of Ulduar itself. The first thing you'll need to do is retrieve the fragments of an access disk from the library's guardians.

column1: This Just In: Fire Still Hot!^75^All^Zul'Drak^Elder Shaman Moky^Elder Shaman Moky^^^^Elder Shaman Moky at Light's Breach in Zul'Drak wants you to use the Rageclaw Fire Extinguisher to douse 15 hut fires at Rageclaw Den.^Trolls attack Rageclaw Den and kick Rageclaw out! It get worse. Trolls now burning village! This very bad. Chief make top Rageclaw shaman
column2: Moky
column3: do study on fire. Results very surprising! Fire still hot and can burn things. Will you help Rageclaw and put fire out? Moky has special Rageclaw fire extinguisher for you. Use special fire extinguisher to put out fire at Rageclaw Den to southeast. Sometimes take many sprays to douse fire
column4: but extinguisher always have water! Rageclaw magic strong!

column1: Data Mining^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Brann Bronzebeard^Brann Bronzebeard^Sniffing Out the Perpetrator^^^Use the Inventor's Disk to retrieve 7 pieces of Hidden Data from the Databanks.^That disk you assembled... it's blank! That crafty Mimir must've hidden the information somewhere else. Look around the Inventor's Library; do you see any databanks there? That might be what you need to do with the disk. Try using it near some of those databanks. Perhaps it's set to retrieve and store information from them. After you've tried your hand at that
column2: contact me again and let me know what you've found. Meanwhile
column3: I'll be trying to track down the other half of the archive key.

column1: Trolls Is Gone Crazy!^75^All^Zul'Drak^Chief Rageclaw^Chief Rageclaw^^^^Chief Rageclaw at Light's Breach in Zul'Drak wants you to use the Drakuru "Lock Openers" found on various Drakuru trolls to free 8 Captured Rageclaw.^Drakuru... You know who this troll is? I think bad troll are controlled by the Drakuru troll. They call themself Drakuru trolls - that how I know. Now you see why I am chief of Rageclaw. Smartest of all wolvar! But that not why I talk to you now. Bad troll come and kick Rageclaw out of den. Rageclaw that no run away held as prisoner in village. You go to Rageclaw Den
column2: southeast
column3: and free captured Rageclaw. Kill troll for lock opener. You maybe kill many troll for many lock opener.

column1: When All Else Fails^78^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Ricket^Rork Sharpchin^^Demolitionist Extraordinaire^^Speak to Ricket to make use of Ricket's D16 Propelled Delivery Device to enter further into Storm Peaks.^So... so I don't think we're going to be getting a good foothold in those mountains. Trust me
column2: I'm not one to give up easily... but between freezing engines
column3: nasty vrykul women
column4: territorial dragon want-to-bes and the half a dozen other nasties settled in the area
column5: this just ain't happening. Don't let that dissuade you though! Just because we can't get a foothold doesn't mean we won't get you there... one-way trips are pretty simple when you get down to it. <Ricket nods at some nearby rockets.>

column1: Offering Thanks^78^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Lagnus^Glorthal Stiffbeard^Offering Thanks^^^Bring the crate of medical supplies to Glorthal Stiffbeard in Frosthold.^Ah! Thanks for coming up here
column2: <lad/lass>. Judging by your wide eyes and shivering hands
column3: I'd venture a guess that you're somewhat new. Sounds like it would be good for you to meet our gracious hosts then! We've got some extra medical supplies... to be honest
column4: we weren't expecting to have such a comfortable setup. Go ahead and give this crate to Glorthal over there
column5: and lend them a hand if you would too. We don't want them to think we're ungrateful for how welcoming they've been.

column1: Missing Scouts^78^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Glorthal Stiffbeard^Glorthal Stiffbeard^Offering Thanks^^^Glorthal in Frosthold has requested a search of the Bor's Breath valley and Bor's Fall for any sign of the missing Frostborn Scouts.^There is something that I could use a hand with now that I have you. We have a few scouts that are extremely late in returning. The peaks are harsh... but these boys know what they're doing. Head to the east... along the Bor's Breath valley and near Bor's Fall... they should be out that direction. If you find any sign of one of them
column2: bring me back news immediately. We have a few enemies in the area - if any of them are getting a bit uppity
column3: the more warning the better.

column1: Loyal Companions^78^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Fjorlin Frostbrow^Fjorlin Frostbrow^Loyal Companions^^^Fjorlin Frostbrow at Frosthold wants you to obtain 8 slabs of Fresh Ice Rhino Meat and use them to feed the Stormcrest Eagles above town.^Fresh blood! Good to meet ya! I've got some work if you've got some time. Off to the east are the Foot Steppes... pretty hard land
column2: but there's quite a group of rhino that graze there. Our birds have a taste for that rhino meat
column3: but it's always a bit dangerous for them to go hunting with all of the proto-drakes that nest around there. If you're keen
column4: head over that way and get some rhino meat
column5: bring it back to the peaks above here
column6: and then use it to feed some of the eagles that nest there.

column1: Stemming the Aggressors^78^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Glorthal Stiffbeard^Glorthal Stiffbeard^Offering Thanks^^^Glorthal Stiffbeard at Frosthold wants you to kill 8 Frostfeather Screechers and 8 Frostfeather Witches.^Damn harpies. We've beat that bunch into submission more times than I can remember... and they stay quiet for a time after each bout. This time
column2: I'd thought that maybe it sunk in. Apparently not. Their memory may be a bit short
column3: but if their numbers are thinned enough
column4: they'll keep to themselves. Head into the valleys in the north and east and clear out a fair chunk of them for me
column5: will ya?

column1: Baby Stealers^78^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Fjorlin Frostbrow^Fjorlin Frostbrow^Loyal Companions^^^Fjorlin Frostbrow at Frosthold would like you to bring back 15 Stormcrest Eagle Eggs.^A few weeks ago
column2: if you looked up
column3: you'd see dozens of those beautiful eagles soaring the skies. Now
column4: only a few if any. They've taken to staying with their nests nearly all the time now because the harpies have been stealing their eggs. The harpies have grown a taste for eagle flesh
column5: it seems... the sick wretches are caring for the eggs long enough to feast on the hatchlings. Go into the valleys to the north or the east and find the eggs... bring them back here
column6: and I'll take them back to the nests.

column1: Sirana Iceshriek^78^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Glorthal Stiffbeard^Glorthal Stiffbeard^Offering Thanks^^^Glorthal Stiffbeard at Frosthold wants you to kill Sirana Iceshriek.^This Sirana Iceshriek sounds like the one that's spurring the harpies to be more aggressive. If we kill her
column2: I suspect their attacks won't last long afterwards. One of our stormriders claims to have spotted her circling the peak directly northwest of here. Go find the wench and put her down. Let's see this done.

column1: Pushed Too Far^78^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Fjorlin Frostbrow^Fjorlin Frostbrow^^^^Fjorlin Frostbrow at Frosthold wants you to ride with a Stormcrest Eagle and kill 16 Stormpeak Wyrms in the Foot Steppes.^You were there with Loken
column2: weren't you? The iron dwarves captured Veranus
column3: the brood mother of the proto-drakes. The drakes don't seem even a little bit happy about the situation... they've gotten very aggressive. They've pushed into stormcrest territory and the eagles have taken to an all out fight with them. It's time to return the favor. We're riding to the Foot Steppes and slaughtering them there. King Stormheart left this hammer to me - make good use and see to it that I get it back.

column1: Ancient Relics^78^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Rork Sharpchin^Rork Sharpchin^^^^Return 10 Relics of Ulduar to Rork Sharpchin in Frosthold.^Why hello thar! Before you be headin' off to do your grand questin' and adventure
column2: might I beg a wee favor of ya
column3: <lad/lass>? These mountains be packed full'a precious relics and baubles... this place be a dream come true for tha league. I'd be much obliged if ya could bring any such treasures you stumble upon back ta me. You can even share in me ale for tha trouble! Trust me <lad/lass>
column4: that's a rich deal!

column1: Aid from the Explorers' League^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Brann Bronzebeard^Lagnus^Aid from the Explorers' League^Norgannon's Shell^^Take Norgannon's Shell to Lagnus at Frosthold.^Interesting. I don't see any locking mechanisms on the shell. That suggests to me that it may take more than just finding the other piece to combine the keystone. Take the shell back to the expedition leader
column2: Lagnus
column3: at Frosthold. Once he gets over his awe
column4: he should be able to glean what the core looks like based on the shell
column5: and maybe they can get the Frost Dwarves to help find it. I'm going to see if I can find out how to combine the two pieces. We'll catch up once we've both made some progress.

column1: Norgannon's Shell^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Inventor's Library Console^Brann Bronzebeard^Sniffing Out the Perpetrator^^Aid from the Explorers' League
column2: The Exiles of Ulduar^Recover Norgannon's Shell from Archivist Mechaton.^Charging inventor's disk. Disk charging completed. Preparing emergency protocol gamma. Emergency protocol loaded. Please use the charged disk to activate the guardian of Norgannon's shell
column3: Archivist Mechaton. The archivist will release the shell once your identity has been verified. Please have a pleasant millennium.

column1: The Frostborn King^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Lagnus^Yorg Stormheart^Aid from the Explorers' League^^^Speak to Yorg Stormheart in Frosthold.^Definitely... I can see exactly what the core must look like. If any of the frostborn have seen it
column2: they'll be sure to recognize the description. There's no time to waste
column3: let's get straight to business. Go talk to King Stormheart and request his aid... he's sure to know someone who can help us find the core. And be nice about it will you - he's very respected around here.

column1: Fervor of the Frostborn^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Yorg Stormheart^Yorg Stormheart^Aid from the Explorers' League^^^Yorg Stormheart at Frosthold has requested that you speak to Fjorlin Frostbrow to secure a ride and face your challenge.^I be more than willing ta lend my shelter and home ta travelers in need
column2: but I'm nae too keen ta force my people inte yer affairs. I'll tell ye what... my people are warriors
column3: straight and true. On the day a frostborn becomes a man
column4: he has ta prove himself in battle. He has ta show us that he'll not let size hold'm back. Show me yer as strong and fierce as one of my men
column5: and I'll have them lend ye an ear or a blade. Speak ta Fjorlin over by the cliff to the south there and he'll put ye ta the test.

column1: An Experienced Guide^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Yorg Stormheart^Drom Frostgrip^Aid from the Explorers' League^^^Locate Drom Frostgrip.^I don't know where this core is hiding
column2: but ye knew that. I said I'd help though
column3: and that I shall. There's a hermit by the name of Drom Frostgrip who lives in a cave north of here... down in tha valley. We've strayed away from the titans a bit ourselves being that there are so few about
column4: but Drom's loyal to the old ways... he keeps an eye on their most precious places and speaks te the keeper Creteus often. Yer sure to find him in the back of his cave... tell'm I sent ye and he'll help ye.

column1: Unwelcome Guests^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Fjorlin Frostbrow^Fjorlin Frostbrow^^^^Fjorlin Frostbrow at Frosthold wants you to kill 10 Stormforged Invaders.^Our scouts have spotted iron dwarves in the valley north of here. I overheard King Stormheart sending you to visit Drom and I'm admittedly a bit worried about'm. If you find any iron dwarves when you head down there
column2: put'm down hard and fast for me
column3: eh? I dun think they know exactly where we are or how to get here just yet
column4: and I'd prefer to keep it that way.

column1: The Lonesome Watcher^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Drom Frostgrip^Creteus^Aid from the Explorers' League^^^Recover Frostgrip's Signet Ring from an Iron Dwarf Monitor and then bring it to Creteus in the Foot Steppes.^I never found the core... but I've often spoken to the keeper Creteus
column2: and his omissions give him away. You'll find Creteus over the mountains to the east
column3: in the Foot Steppes
column4: keeping watch on the Engine of the Makers. The core might well be in there
column5: but you'll need to win Creteus's favor. The iron dwarves were here looking for something... it might well be the core. They took my ring. Find their leader
column6: get the ring back
column7: and show it to Creteus so that he knows I sent you.

column1: The Hidden Relic^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Creteus^The Guardian's Charge^Aid from the Explorers' League^^^Creteus in the Foot Steppes has provided you with the information to locate Norgannon's Core.^During your absence
column2: I was privileged enough to parley with the dwarf Brann Bronzebeard. This dwarf indicated his purpose for seeking the keystone
column3: and I am satisfied that it is for satisfactory intent... I believe this dwarf may be the entity for which the keystone was created. Norgannon's Core is located in the Frigid Tomb to the southeast. Its guardians are ancient beings of ice
column4: and they will not welcome your presence. Best these guardians and retrieve the keystone with my blessing
column5: <race>.

column1: Fury of the Frostborn King^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^The Guardian's Charge^Creteus^Aid from the Explorers' League^^^Bring Norgannon's Core back to Creteus in the Foot Steppes.^<As you retrieve the core from the chest
column2: you hear the thumping of heavy footsteps rushing towards you from the corridor. There is the faint sound of battle in the distance.>

column1: The Master Explorer^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Creteus^Brann Bronzebeard^Aid from the Explorers' League^^^Bring Norgannon's Core to Brann Bronzebeard in the Engine of the Makers.^Combining the keystone will require Norgannon's Binding - a device located in the Engine of the Makers
column2: the large pit beside us. Brann should be down there with the other half of the keystone now. I have instructed him on the use of the device. He awaits your presence. I will do what I can to keep the iron dwarves occupied
column3: but I do not have confidence that I will hold them for long. King Stormheart is returning to the defense of Frosthold with some of his men shortly. Please hurry
column4: <race>.

column1: Ancient Relics^78^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Olut Alegut^Olut Alegut^^^^Return 10 Relics of Ulduar to Olut Alegut at the Grom'arsh Crash-site.^Welcome to the peaks. I have a simple request before you head off on whatever grand jaunt you have planned. There are relics and treasures of ancient Ulduar scattered through these mountains. Most are likely in possession of the various sentient races. Return any that you find to me
column2: and I will reward you in kind. Perhaps I'll even let you partake on my many potent ales.

column1: Orders From Drakuru^75^All^Zul'Drak^Orders From Drakuru^Crusader Lord Lantinga^In Search Of Answers^^Crusader Forward Camp^Return the Orders From Drakuru to Crusader Lord Lantinga at Light's Breach in Zul'Drak.^Minions be hearin' da call of your masta! Da Lich King be givin' Drakuru full control of da armies of da Scourge in Zul'Drak. We be commanded ta kill everyting. EVERYTING MUST DIE! We be processin' all da corpses in da Dead Fields and sendin' em up ta Prince Navarius' crew in Zeramas for Scourgin'! Notin' goes ta waste on Drakuru's watch! Soon we be drinkin' da blood of da prophets ta become stronger dan eva before! Zul'Drak and Gundrak gonna fall to da Scourge!
The Ebon Watch^75^All^Zul'Drak^Crusader Lord Lantinga^Stefan Vadu^In Search Of Answers^^^Deliver the Orders From Drakuru to Stefan Vadu at Ebon Watch in Zul'Drak.^West of here
column2: across the ruined roads and structures
column3: is the death knight encampment of Ebon Watch. <Crusader Lord Lantinga rolls up Drakuru's orders.> Take these orders and deliver them to Stefan Vadu. He is the death knight in command at Ebon Watch. Let him know that the Argent Crusade will deal with Prince Navarius. They'll have to handle Drakuru. Be careful
column4: <name>. The way to Ebon Watch is teeming with Scourge.

column1: The Exiles of Ulduar^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Brann Bronzebeard^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^^Norgannon's Shell^^Speak with Bouldercrag the Rockshaper at Bouldercrag's Refuge.^The Storm Peaks are an intriguing place
column2: but there's far more here than titan ruins. The peoples who live here face a dire threat in Loken and his minions. He sent his favorite servants
column3: the iron dwarves
column4: on a brutal campaign against all the creatures of stone. He expelled the earthen from Ulduar
column5: forcing them to take shelter at Bouldercrag's Refuge
column6: on the face of a mountain west of the Inventor's Library. Bouldercrag and his brethren are beset by the iron dwarves there. Find and help them
column7: <name>.

column1: The Drakkensryd^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Gretta the Arbiter^Thorim^The Last of Her Kind^^Maintaining Discipline
column2: Defending Your Title^Use the Hyldnir Harpoon to defeat 10 Hyldsmeet Drakeriders at the Temple of Storms. Use the Hyldnir Harpoon on a Column Ornament to exit the Drakkensryd and speak to Thorim when you've succeeded.^This is it. You've passed all the tests of the Hyldsmeet... all but one. You've risen among our sisters' best and fiercest. The final test is at hand. The Drakkensryd - the true test of a Hyldnir's worth and warrior spirit. It'll be you
column3: your riding drake
column4: a chained harpoon and a score of your sisters vying for dominance. Show no quarter. None will be expected.

column1: It's All Fun and Games^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Thassarian^Baron Sliver^It's All Fun and Games^^I Have an Idea
column2: But First...^Destroy The Ocular and then report to Baron Sliver at The Shadow Vault.^The Knights of the Ebon Blade want to take the Scourge base known as The Shadow Vault to the northwest. I have a contact in their group who has asked for help. The first step is to blind the Lich King. He's using a device known as The Ocular to watch the area
column3: which floats above the vault's spires. Our dwarves have created something for you to use against it. After the 'eye' has been destroyed
column4: find Baron Sliver on the vault grounds. He's pretending to still be under the Lich King's will.

column1: SCRAP-E^80^All^The Storm Peaks^SCRAP-E Access Card^SCRAP-E^^^The Prototype Console^Bring the SCRAP-E Access Card along with 4 Handfuls of Cobalt Bolts and 5 Overcharged Capacitors to SCRAP-E at The Inventor's Library.^This card allows the user to access the control panel of the scrapbot designated SCRAP-E
column2: in order to perform maintenance and reprogram the bot's directives. SCRAP-E appears to be assigned to the interior of the building at The Inventor's Library. The card displays a list of the bot's broken components and failing systems. With the proper parts
column3: the bot can be restored to working condition.

column1: The Prototype Console^80^All^The Storm Peaks^SCRAP-E^Prototype Console^^SCRAP-E^^Relevant Locations^Designation SCRAP-E. Directive: Maintain consoles and databases of Inventor's Library in Keeper Mimir's absences. Time since last maintenance cycle: 489 days. Status of schematic data: unknown. Current tasks: Repair prototype console.
I Have an Idea
column2: But First...^80^All^Icecrown^Baron Sliver^Baron Sliver^It's All Fun and Games^^^Baron Sliver at The Shadow Vault has asked you to collect a Cultist Rod
column3: an Abomination Hook
column4: a Geist Rope
column5: and 5 Scourge Essences.^When I was in the - ahem - employ of the Lich King
column6: we would often use a device known as a sovereign rod to keep some of the more intelligent Scourge in line. I require that you assist me in the construction of a new one. Luckily for you
column7: all of the necessary components are at hand: a cultist rod
column8: an abomination hook
column9: a geist rope
column10: and a handful of Scourge essences. This should not be difficult
column11: <class>.

column1: It's All Fun and Games^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Baron Sliver^It's All Fun and Games^^I Have an Idea
column2: But First...^Destroy The Ocular and then report to Baron Sliver at The Shadow Vault.^The Knights of the Ebon Blade want to take the Scourge base known as The Shadow Vault to the northwest. I have a contact in their group who has asked for help. The first step is to blind the Lich King. He's using a device known as The Ocular to watch the area
column3: which floats above the vault's spires. Our goblins have created something for you to use against it. After the 'eye' has been destroyed
column4: find Baron Sliver on the vault grounds. He's pretending to still be under the Lich King's will.

column1: Free Your Mind^80^All^Icecrown^Baron Sliver^Baron Sliver^It's All Fun and Games^^If He Cannot Be Turned
column2: If He Cannot Be Turned^Baron Sliver at the Shadow Vault wants you to use the Sovereign Rod on the corpses of Vile
column3: Lady Nightswood
column4: and The Leaper.^Vile
column5: Lady Nightswood
column6: and The Leaper would make excellent weapons in the fight against the Lich King if they can be broken from his will. That is what the Sovereign Rod is for. You'll find them on the ledges to the east and west of the vault
column7: as well as on the mid-tier of the vault above us. The rod is to be used upon the corpses of the three. Fly now. We will have them as our own!

column1: Crusader Forward Camp^75^All^Zul'Drak^Crusader Lord Lantinga^Crusader MacKellar^Crusader Forward Camp^Orders From Drakuru^Making Something Out Of Nothing
column2: A Great Storm Approaches^Seek out Crusader MacKellar at the Crusader Forward Camp in Zul'Drak.^Crusader Dargath
column3: Crusader MacKellar
column4: Engineer Reed and the twins
column5: Gerk and Burr
column6: were sent to the Dead Fields to establish a battle front days ago. As of my last correspondence with them
column7: they had successfully established a camp on the border of the Dead Fields
column8: northwest of here. In light of this newfound information about Drakuru and Prince Navarius I think it would be prudent to send someone to the Crusader Forward Camp post-haste. Pack up your belongings
column9: <name>. You must leave at once!

column1: The Missing Bronzebeard^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Boktar Bloodfury^Boktar Bloodfury^The Missing Bronzebeard^^^Retrieve the Burlap-Wrapped Note from Brann's camp and return it to Boktar Bloodfury at the Grom'arsh Crash-Site.^Before we left
column2: I received the file Scout Vor'takh compiled on this Brann Bronzebeard. There can be no doubt that Brann was headed for the Storm Peaks from his journal entries and findings in Grizzly Hills. Before we crashed
column3: I caught sight of a campsite south of here
column4: across the Foot Steppes
column5: and overlooking the frozen Bor's Breath River. If Brann isn't there
column6: search the camp and its environs for any clues as to where that blasted dwarf might've gone. Bring back anything you find.

column1: If He Cannot Be Turned^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Baron Sliver^Thassarian^If He Cannot Be Turned^Free Your Mind^^Defeat General Lightsbane and then report your success back to Thassarian aboard the gunship
column2: The Skybreaker.^Death knights
column3: such as General Lightsbane
column4: are held on too tight of a leash to be able to be turned from the Lich King's will except under the most extraordinary circumstances. The general keeps himself within the vault overseeing the creation of new weapons. Disturb one of his weapon racks at the northern forge and I assure you
column5: he will come. I'll send Vile
column6: Lady Nightswood
column7: and The Leaper in to help you. If we are to finally own The Shadow Vault
column8: General Lightsbane must fall!

column1: If He Cannot Be Turned^80^Horde^Icecrown^Baron Sliver^Koltira Deathweaver^If He Cannot Be Turned^Free Your Mind^^Defeat General Lightsbane and then report your success back to Koltira Deathweaver aboard the gunship
column2: Orgrim's Hammer.^Death knights
column3: such as General Lightsbane
column4: are held on too tight of a leash to be able to be turned from the Lich King's will except under the most extraordinary circumstances. The general keeps himself within the vault overseeing the creation of new weapons. Disturb one of his weapon racks at the northern forge and I assure you
column5: he will come. I'll send Vile
column6: Lady Nightswood
column7: and The Leaper in to help you. If we are to finally own The Shadow Vault
column8: General Lightsbane must fall!

column1: The Shadow Vault^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Thassarian^Baron Sliver^If He Cannot Be Turned^^The Duke^Report back to Baron Sliver at The Shadow Vault.^It sounds like you did extremely well. And you secured three very important allies for the Knights of the Ebon Blade in the process. <Thassarian gazes out over the horizon.> You should head back. By now
column2: Baron Sliver and the other death knights will be fighting tooth and nail to hold The Shadow Vault against the might of the Scourge. I'm sure they'll need your help.

column1: The Shadow Vault^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Baron Sliver^If He Cannot Be Turned^^The Duke^Report back to Baron Sliver at The Shadow Vault.^It sounds like you did extremely well. And you secured three very important allies for the Knights of the Ebon Blade in the process. <Koltira gazes down at the map on the floor.> You should head back. By now
column2: Baron Sliver and the other death knights will be fighting tooth and nail to hold The Shadow Vault against the might of the Scourge. I'm sure they'll need your help.

column1: Making a Harness^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Astrid Bjornrittar^Astrid Bjornrittar^They Took Our Men!^^The Last of Her Kind
column2: The Slithering Darkness^Astrid Bjornrittar in Brunnhildar Village wants you to obtain 3 Icemane Yeti Hides.^So you want to ride? Well
column3: if you've made it this far someone must think you've got a shot at the Hyldsmeet. First things first; we'll have to make you a harness. In the cliffs to the south
column4: you'll find scattered groups of yeti. Their hides are tough and just the right thickness. Bring me some and we'll get you started on the path of the bear-rider.

column1: Making Something Out Of Nothing^76^All^Zul'Drak^Engineer Reed^Engineer Reed^^Crusader Forward Camp^^Engineer Reed at Crusader Forward Camp in Zul'Drak has asked that you recover 10 pieces of Scourge Scrap Metal.^Prince Navarius must be stopped. We can't let the Scourge continue to use this area as a zombie factory. If we can get the tank operational we might stand a chance. What I need right now are spare parts. Northwest of here is an area called Thrym's End. The Scourge armies are using the area as a base of sorts. Spread out across the base is the wreckage from their arrival. Bits and pieces of Scourge scrap metal litter the landscape. Get that stuff to me and I'll try and put it to good use.

In Search Of Answers^75^All^Zul'Drak^Crusader Lord Lantinga^Orders From Drakuru^In Search Of Answers^^^Search Rageclaw Den for a clue about who or what initiated the attacks against the Rageclaw Wolvar.^These poor creatures are the only survivors. According to their chief
column2: the Drakkari trolls and Rageclaw wolvar have been allies for thousands of years. They've been living here
column3: alongside the trolls
column4: for generations
column5: completely unaware of the ever changing world around them. To the Rageclaw
column6: a troll is a troll
column7: so the troll attack upon their den took them by surprise. We need some answers
column8: <name>. Scour their village - southeast of here - for clues as to who or what is in charge of these attacks.

column1: That's What Friends Are For...^76^All^Zul'Drak^Crusader MacKellar^Crusader MacKellar^Crusader Forward Camp^^Light Won't Grant Me Vengeance^Crusader MacKellar at Crusader Forward Camp has asked that you find Crusader Dargath
column2: Gerk and Burr.^We were attacked by Prince Navarius and at least a dozen Scourge. I told Dargath and the twins to stay inside the tank
column3: but they wouldn't listen. Dargath looked me in the eyes and said
column4: "If somebody doesn't get out of this tank
column5: they'll kill us all." He then made Reed cut the engine and charged. Most heroic thing I've ever seen. I heard the Prince barking orders to the monsters. Sounded like he was taking them to Thrym's End
column6: northwest of here. We have to rescue our friends. Will you go look for them?

column1: Light Won't Grant Me Vengeance^76^All^Zul'Drak^Gerk^Gerk^^That's What Friends Are For...^^Gerk at Thrym's End in Zul'Drak wants you to kill 15 Vargul.^They... They killed my brother. <Gerk fights back tears.> Slaughtered him like he was some sort of animal. Now they got him laid out on one of their tables on the other side of the camp
column2: ready for their grizzly experiments. Dargath's dead too. The paladin made a heroic stand at the ruins to the northeast
column3: but the leader of the Vargul
column4: Algar
column5: was too strong. I'm all that's left and I'll be dead soon too. I... I'm turning. If the Light won't grant me vengeance
column6: maybe you will
column7: <class>. Kill them all.

column1: Mildred the Cruel^79^All^The Storm Peaks^Lok'lira the Crone^Mildred the Cruel^They Took Our Men!^^^Speak to Mildred the Cruel inside the Forlorn Mine.^Our deal is made then
column2: <name>. You help me get out of these chains and I'll help you find your little green friend. The Hyldnir who runs this mine is known as Mildred the Cruel -- and with good reason. Tell her you've been sent to lend a hand with the mines. Do whatever she asks until she trusts you with the keys to my shackles.

column1: Discipline^79^All^The Storm Peaks^Mildred the Cruel^Mildred the Cruel^They Took Our Men!^^^Mildred the Cruel at the Forlorn Mine wants you to use the Disciplining Rod on 6 Exhausted Vrykul.^Let's start you off with something straightforward. The male vrykul that work the mines for us do so against their will... purely out of fear of our blades. Once in a while
column2: one of them will lose their motivation. Find any uncooperative vrykul and put them in their place. Take this disciplining rod. You'll want to inflict pain
column3: not death. Well
column4: most of the time anyway.

column1: Examples to be Made^79^All^The Storm Peaks^Mildred the Cruel^Mildred the Cruel^They Took Our Men!^^^Mildred the Cruel at the Forlorn Mine wants you to slay Garhal.^For every action there is an opposite reaction
column2: sister. In the case of us applying pressure on the males
column3: this has meant newly spread rumors of insurrection. The bearded pig behind this rabble-rousing is called Garhal. Put an end to him... and make sure the other males see his demise. They must learn that insubordination will not be tolerated.

column1: A Certain Prisoner^79^All^The Storm Peaks^Mildred the Cruel^Lok'lira the Crone^They Took Our Men!^^^Take Mildred's Key to Lok'lira the Crone in the Forlorn Mine.^You are without mercy. You will do well around these parts. I have another task to ask of you. There is a female vrykul prisoner that's become more of a liability than I had anticipated. She had the gall to claim the right to take part in the Hyldsmeet
column2: our sacred competition of strength and fighting prowess. Here's the key to her shackles. Make it as painless as possible. She's a female after all
column3: even if not one of us.

column1: The Nose Knows^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Boktar Bloodfury^Khaliisi^The Missing Bronzebeard^^^Speak with Khaliisi at the foot of the mountain east of the Grom'arsh Crash-Site.^In order to track down Brann
column2: we're going to need a creature with a keen sense of smell and a good tracking ability. There weren't any hounds on the zeppelin
column3: but I think I have a substitute. After the crash
column4: I sent Khaliisi down the east face of the mountain to start hunting for food. Her cat
column5: Frostbite
column6: excels at tracking prey in the snow. Tell her that she'll have to part with her companion for a while
column7: at least. She can hunt on her own
column8: but we have no other way of catching up to Brann Bronzebeard.

column1: Sniffing Out the Perpetrator^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Khaliisi^Brann Bronzebeard^The Missing Bronzebeard^^^Mount Frostbite and ride her to the source of the scent from Brann's note. Then
column2: recover Brann's Communicator and use it to make contact with Brann Bronzebeard.^Boktar can have his way this time
column3: but I'll expect him to make it up to me. Don't look at me like that. Boktar may be in command
column4: but no one tells a hunter what to do. 'Put that beast away
column5: ' he says. 'Make it stop growling.' All of a sudden he changes his mind when it suits him. Next time he complains
column6: Frostbite'll just nip him a bit. Don't worry
column7: she'll do an admirable job tracking your prey. After she locates her target
column8: you're on your own to deal with iron dwarves
column9: or Brann
column10: or whatever you find.

column1: A Great Storm Approaches^76^All^Zul'Drak^Gymer^Engineer Reed^A Great Storm Approaches^Crusader Forward Camp^^Gymer
column2: King of Storm Giants
column3: has asked you to find a way to release him from his cage. Speak with Engineer Reed at the Crusader Forward Camp.^You are not like the others
column4: little one. You do not reek of the ancient death. Perhaps you can be trusted. I am Gymer
column5: king of the storm giants. I was lured here by my brother
column6: Thiassi
column7: now an undead servant of the Lich King. By the time I realized that his cry for help was a trap
column8: it was too late. I am now a prisoner of the Scourge and I fear that soon I will suffer the same fate as many of the other storm giants. Find a way to release me from this cage and I will aid you to the best of my ability.

column1: Speak Orcish
column2: Man!^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Brann Bronzebeard^Moteha Windborn^The Missing Bronzebeard^^^Speak with Moteha Windborn at the Grom'arsh Crash-Site.^<Brann begins gesticulating wildly and rambling in his native language.> Ruk MogOth red a mogoth ta eft Thros-garE Haldir. Kha gor ruk khaz ta ke ruk hrim eft thros-am-kha ruk kost-um havar go kost. A modoss hine ruk bergum eft thros-am-kha ga eft Haldir ke loch Thon we lo gefrunon ta mitta.  Gar Ruk dagUm loch angor-magi ta har ruk! <After a few moments
column3: you realize the conversation is going nowhere. Perhaps the shaman
column4: Moteha Windborn
column5: at the Grom'arsh Crash-Site will know what to do.>

column1: Gymer's Salvation^76^All^Zul'Drak^Engineer Reed^Engineer Reed^A Great Storm Approaches^^^Engineer Reed at Crusader Forward Camp in Zul'Drak wants you to bring him 6 Banshee Essence and 6 Diatomaceous Earth.^Now you say that he's locked up in a 100 foot tall cage
column2: eh? If my calculations are correct
column3: we should be able to at least weaken the hinges on the cage
column4: giving the giant enough leeway to break out. If this is going to work I'm going to need some plasticizers and stabilizers. Banshee essence should do nicely for the plasticizer. You can get that from the banshees in the Dead Fields
column5: northeast of us. The stabilizer can be found on the earthragers to the southwest
column6: near Ebon Watch. Get a move on!

column1: Mending Fences^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Thorim^Thorim^The Last of Her Kind^^^Thorim at the Temple of Storms wants you to Kill Fjorn and 5 Stormforged Iron Giants at Fjorn's Anvil
column2: east of Dun Niffelem.^If I hope to wrest control of the Temple of the Makers from my brother
column3: I must make amends with my old allies. Perhaps by eliminating a common enemy
column4: we may at least take a step towards renewing my friendship with the frost giants. Fjorn has besieged Dun Niffelem with giants of iron. You must defeat him at Fjorn's Anvil
column5: far to the east of here
column6: and weaken his forces sufficiently for the Sons of Hodir to emerge victorious. Take this charm
column7: <name>. Use it to summon my earthen to your aid.

column1: Our Only Hope^76^All^Zul'Drak^Engineer Reed^Gymer^A Great Storm Approaches^^^Speak to Gymer at Thrym's End in Zul'Drak once you have used the Jumbo Seaforium Charge to open the Scourge Enclosure that is holding him prisoner.^What I'm about to give you is called seaforium. It is a highly volatile explosive with some unique properties. Due to its malleable nature
column2: you will be able to fill in the hinges and cracks of the cage for maximum damage. Return to your friend and use the jumbo seaforium charge to set him free. Let's hope he honors the bargain. He's our only hope.

column1: Speaking with the Wind's Voice^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Moteha Windborn^Moteha Windborn^The Missing Bronzebeard^^Catching up with Brann^Bring 5 Voices of the Wind to Moteha Windborn at the Grom'arsh Crash-Site.^I suppose we shouldn't have expected to find Brann so easily
column2: not with our luck. If we can make sense of what Brann is saying
column3: you can persuade him to give up his location. The power of the wind is strong in these mountains
column4: and it may prove a great boon to us. A knowledgeable shaman can hear the sound of all the world's tongues on the wind. To the northwest
column5: on the Snowdrift Plains
column6: you will find beings made of wind
column7: the stormriders. Capture their voices and bring them to me.

column1: Gem Perfection^65^Alliance^Jewelcrafting^Ounhulo^Ounhulo^^^^Return two Huge Citrines
column2: two Dark Jade and two Shadow Crystals to Ounhulo in Valgarde.^It has the cold of the Icewyrm's breath up here does it not? Not only do I lack customers for my crafting skills
column3: but I also lack stock of gems to sell! If you can bring me several uncut gems to replenish my stocks
column4: I can teach you the skill of gem perfection. This will allow you to sometimes cut a perfect gem with increased bonuses when cutting a uncommon quality gem from Northrend.

column1: The Storm King's Vengeance^76^All^Zul'Drak^Gymer^Crusader MacKellar^A Great Storm Approaches^^^Speak with Gymer to begin.^My people have been decimated by the Lich King. The Scourge now use the corpses of storm giants to create mindless flesh giants
column2: or worse
column3: stitched together aberrations like Thrym. I will stop at nothing to see them all driven from this world. We will work together to destroy the Scourge that threaten Zul'Drak. We will kill them all: Navarius
column4: Algar and Thrym! When you are ready
column5: let me know and we will begin our destructive journey.

column1: Catching up with Brann^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Boktar Bloodfury^Boktar Bloodfury^Catching up with Brann^Speaking with the Wind's Voice^^Use Brann's Communicator to contact Brann Bronzebeard and speak with him
column2: then speak to Boktar Bloodfury at the Grom'arsh Crash-Site.^What are you waiting for? The language barrier has been broken
column3: thanks to Moteha. Contact Brann Bronzebeard and find out anything you can about where he's hiding and what he's chasing after. Maybe we can still salvage something from this disaster.

column1: A Change of Scenery^79^All^The Storm Peaks^Lok'lira the Crone^Lok'lira the Crone^They Took Our Men!^^^Reconvene with Lok'lira the Crone in Brunnhildar Village.^Excellent. There's an exit in the eastern end of the mine that leads to Brunnhildar Village. Follow it and I'll meet you there. We must not be seen together so no one suspects you of aiding me. I'll use my magic to disguise my appearance. Do not worry
column2: <race> -- we'll find your friend in no time.

column1: The Refiner's Fire^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Slag Covered Metal^Fjorn's Anvil^The Refiner's Fire^^^You must collect 10 Furious Sparks from the Seething Revenants at Frostfield Lake and then use the anvil at Fjorn's Anvil.^Beneath its porous exterior
column2: this hunk of metal gleams with a mysterious quality. You feel it would only be prudent to burn off the slag at Fjorn's Anvil. As you ponder where in this frozen waste you might find something hot enough for the job
column3: a fire revenant crosses your path...

column1: Forging an Alliance^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Thorim^Njormeld^Forging an Alliance^A Spark of Hope^^You are to go to Dun Niffelem and ask King Jokkum to allow Thorim's armor to be reforged. After completing Jokkum's task
column2: you are to speak with Njormeld in Dun Niffelem.^<Thorim
column3: for the first time since your meeting him
column4: smiles.> This is all beginning to have the smell of fate's hand
column5: <race>. Your discovery is what remains of my armor
column6: long ago cast off in a fit of grief and left to the elements. Only the sons of Hodir are capable of its reforging
column7: for they are its original creators. Perhaps you've done enough to soften their hatred of me. Seek out their king
column8: Jokkum
column9: if he still breathes. Find your way into his good graces and plead for his assistance.

column1: Aberrations^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Thyra Kvinnshal^Thyra Kvinnshal^^^The Aberrations Must Die^Thyra Kvinnshal in Brunnhildar Village wants you to go to Valkyrion and obtain Vials of Frost Oil from the Valkyrion Aspirants. Use the Vials of Frost Oil to destroy 30 Plagued Proto-Drake Eggs.^The Lich King sent emissaries to us on three different occasions. All three were promptly dismembered. Our sisters in Valkyrion were not as dedicated to our traditions and accepted the Scourge's advances. Now instead of capturing their drakes from the wild
column2: they raise them from the blight and filth that the Scourge wallow in. Take the frost oil that the Valkyrion Hyldnir carry on them and use it to freeze any blighted eggs you find. Rumors speak of a fetid pool of blight where the eggs are kept.

column1: Pieces of the Puzzle^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Boktar Bloodfury^Brann Bronzebeard^Catching up with Brann^^^Use Brann's Communicator to contact Brann Bronzebeard and find out what to do next.^We've seen the iron dwarves and their constructs making war on the creatures of stone that Brann calls the earthen
column2: along with their giant allies. Contact him and aid him in any way you can
column3: and remember that anything we can learn from his search may aid us in fighting against the iron dwarves and their master.

column1: Data Mining^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Brann Bronzebeard^Brann Bronzebeard^Catching up with Brann^^^Use the Inventor's Disk to retrieve 7 pieces of Hidden Data from the Databanks.^That disk you assembled... it's blank! Keeper Mimir
column2: the tinker who built this library
column3: must've hidden the information elsewhere. Look around the Inventor's Library; do you see any databanks there? That might be the disk's purpose. Try using it near some of those databanks. Perhaps it's set to retrieve and store information from them. After you've tried your hand at that
column4: contact me again and let me know what you've found. Meanwhile
column5: I'll be trying to track down the other half of the archive key.

column1: Norgannon's Shell^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Inventor's Library Console^Brann Bronzebeard^Catching up with Brann^^The Earthen of Ulduar
column2: Going After the Core^Recover Norgannon's Shell from Archivist Mechaton.^Charging inventor's disk. Disk charging completed. Preparing emergency protocol gamma. Emergency protocol loaded. Please use the charged disk to activate the guardian of Norgannon's shell
column3: Archivist Mechaton. The archivist will release the shell once your identity has been verified. Please have a pleasant millennium.

column1: The Earthen of Ulduar^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Brann Bronzebeard^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^^Norgannon's Shell^^Speak with Bouldercrag the Rockshaper at Bouldercrag's Refuge.^The earthen who once inhabited
column2: built
column3: and maintained Ulduar were ousted from their home when Loken took over the city. Since then
column4: his iron dwarf followers have relentlessly attacked the exiles. They have taken refuge in an old titan building
column5: which they now call Bouldercrag's Refuge
column6: on the face of a mountain west of the Inventor's Library. Bouldercrag and his brethren fight to keep the irons from overrunning their haven
column7: but they cannot hold their ground long. Find and help them
column8: <name>.

column1: Rare Earth^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^Rare Earth^^Fighting Back
column2: Relief for the Fallen^Use the Earthen Mining Pick to mine 7 clumps of Enchanted Earth. Bring the earth and 5 Frostweave Cloth to Bouldercrag the Rockshaper at Bouldercrag's Refuge.^It seems so long ago that these hammers pounded and hewed stone instead of iron. Our expulsion from Ulduar saw the weakest of us dead and the strongest of our craftsmen reborn as warriors. As the irons beat us back
column3: even the strongest find themselves failing. We can do little for the wounded
column4: save when we have a stock of enchanted earth. We used to mine it from the deposits on the sheer cliff face to the northwest
column5: but the constant battle has prevented us from replenishing our stock. Would you help?

column1: Fighting Back^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^Rare Earth^^Slaves of the Stormforged
column2: The Dark Ore^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper wants you to slay 10 Stormforged Attackers and return to him at Bouldercrag's Refuge. You may kill either Stormforged Raiders or Stormforged Reavers.^The refuge's defenders have done their best to blunt the iron dwarves' attacks
column3: but we keep losing ground inch by inch. My men are hardy
column4: but not tireless. Without reinforcements
column5: it's only a matter of time until we will be overrun. Would you lend your skills to the refuge's defense? It would greatly improve the morale of the defenders and give them -- and me -- hope of mounting a counterattack. Kill any of the stormforged or their creations you encounter outside the refuge.

column1: The Amphitheater of Anguish: Yggdras!^77^All^Zul'Drak^Gurgthock^Wodin the Troll-Servant^^The Champion's Call!^^Get in the arena at the Amphitheater of Anguish and defeat Yggdras! Return to Wodin the Troll-Servant to redeem your reward.^I'll tell you what
column2: buddy
column3: this place is a far cry from the rolling plains of Nagrand. These trolls are dirtier than ogres; but hey
column4: I go where the gold's at! So welcome to Zul'Drak
column5: pal. You're new to this racket
column6: so let me set you straight. I'm the fight promoter and this feisty troll next to me is Wodin
column7: my bodyguard. You're the entertainment. When you wanna fight
column8: let me know and I'll set up the match. If you're ready and got a group of friends with you
column9: we can start! What do you say?

column1: The Amphitheater of Anguish: Magnataur!^77^All^Zul'Drak^Gurgthock^Wodin the Troll-Servant^^^The Amphitheater of Anguish: From Beyond^Get in the arena at the Amphitheater of Anguish and defeat Stinkbeard! Return to Wodin the Troll-Servant to redeem your reward.^This next match is a doozy
column2: buddy! Apparently some magnataur from the Dragonblight wants a piece of the action. You ever fought one of those before? All I can tell you is to aim high! We'll get this party started when you give me the word.

column1: The Amphitheater of Anguish: From Beyond!^77^All^Zul'Drak^Gurgthock^Wodin the Troll-Servant^^The Amphitheater of Anguish: Magnataur!^The Amphitheater of Anguish: Tuskarrmage^Get in the arena at the Amphitheater of Anguish and defeat one of the elemental lords! Return to Wodin the Troll-Servant to redeem your reward.^I'm not gonna lie to you
column2: pal. You might be overmatched here. This next one is a being from the elemental planes! I don't even know what's gonna show up in that arena! If you think you're up to it
column3: get in there and give 'em hell!

column1: The Amphitheater of Anguish: Tuskarrmageddon!^77^All^Zul'Drak^Gurgthock^Wodin the Troll-Servant^^The Amphitheater of Anguish: From Beyond^The Amphitheater of Anguish: Korrak the ^Get in the arena at the Amphitheater of Anguish and defeat Orinoko Tuskbreaker! Return to Wodin the Troll-Servant to redeem your reward.^This next one's fightin' from a dark place
column2: kid. The kind of dark that can only happen when you've been on the flip-side. He's hungry and willing to do whatever it takes to win. Watch yourself! I've heard he wrestles yetis for exercise! We'll start when you're ready.

column1: The Amphitheater of Anguish: Korrak the Bloodrager!^77^All^Zul'Drak^Gurgthock^Wodin the Troll-Servant^^The Amphitheater of Anguish: Tuskarrmage^The Champion of Anguish^Get in the arena at the Amphitheater of Anguish and defeat Korrak the Bloodrager! Return to Wodin the Troll-Servant to redeem your reward.^You're not gonna believe this
column2: pal. Your next fight is against Korrak the Bloodrager! Looks like the Drakkari trolls are pulling a power play! And let me tell you
column3: buddy
column4: he's been sippin' the animal god juice. He's good and ready to pound you into the ground. Are you ready?

column1: Relief for the Fallen^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^^Rare Earth^^Use the Telluric Poultice to heal 8 Fallen Earthen Defenders
column2: then return to Bouldercrag the Rockshaper at Bouldercrag's Refuge.^The refuge's defenders fight bravely
column3: but they cannot keep up with the iron onslaught. With the earth you collected
column4: I can make bandages to help heal the wounds of some of the fallen. The more defenders we can patch up
column5: the longer we'll last out there. Take these poultices and use them to heal the wounds of the fallen defenders outside the refuge. Get as many back into the battle as possible
column6: <name>. Every casualty is one too many.

column1: The Duke^80^All^Icecrown^Baron Sliver^Duke Lankral^If He Cannot Be Turned^^Eliminate the Competition^Speak with Duke Lankral at The Shadow Vault.^We need you focused
column2: <name>. We're barely holding The Shadow Vault as it is. As you can see
column3: we've greatly angered the Lich King. <The baron chuckles.> I need you to speak with Duke Lankral. He's in charge here now. You'll find him inside the vault building proper. Were I you
column4: I would not keep him waiting.

column1: Honor Challenge^80^All^Icecrown^Duke Lankral^Duke Lankral^If He Cannot Be Turned^^Get the Key^Duke Lankral at The Shadow Vault has asked you to use the Challenge Flag to challenge and defeat 6 Mjordin Combatants.^The first step we're going to take is at a place in Jotunheim called the Savage Ledge. It's just over the mountains to the west. On the ledge the vrykul warriors are always sparring
column2: being instructed in the finer arts of battle by their thane's men. I want you to take this flag and issue a challenge to a number of them. Let's demoralize them with the 'mere' skills of a <race>
column3: shall we? <The duke grins
column4: his rotting teeth flashing in the dim light of the vault.>

column1: Off With Their Black Wings^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Iva the Vengeful^Iva the Vengeful^^^^Iva the Vengeful in Brunnhildar Village wants you to go to Valkyrion and slay 12 Nascent Val'kyr.^Traitors. We Hyldnir have little love for them. The dwellers of Valkyrion have gone unpunished for far too long. While we remained loyal to Thorim
column2: they became the Lich King's lapdogs! They call the ones who receive his gift val'kyr. They fly on feathered wings
column3: like the harpies they are. You will find Valkyrion far to the northwest
column4: beyond the Temple of Storms. Slay these winged she-wolves
column5: sister. Slay them and I will reward you with one of my most prized possessions.

column1: Shadow Vault Decree^80^All^Icecrown^Duke Lankral^Duke Lankral^If He Cannot Be Turned^^^Duke Lankral at The Shadow Vault has ordered you to read the Shadow Vault Decree in the presence of Thane Ufrang the Mighty
column2: and then to slay him.^Thane Ufrang the Mighty sits within his hall overlooking the Savage Ledge. I've studied him. The thane is a patient vrykul
column3: with a head for strategy and warfare. He's also shown a penchant for biding his time and not wanting to overplay his hand in the ongoing battle. I need him dead! I've written a decree. Stand before the thane and read it aloud. <The duke arches his eyebrow in amusement.> It should... unnerve him at the least.

column1: The Champion of Anguish^78^All^Zul'Drak^Gurgthock^Wodin the Troll-Servant^^The Amphitheater of Anguish: Korrak the ^^Get in the arena at the Amphitheater of Anguish and defeat Vladof the Butcher! Return to Wodin the Troll-Servant to redeem your reward.^This is the end
column2: my friend! Your last opponent is going to be your greatest challenge. He's a vrykul champion from the steppes of Icecrown and he's out for blood! Defeat him and you'll be crowned the champion of the Amphitheater of Anguish! This fight is going to make us both rich! Let me know when you're ready and we'll start.

column1: Get the Key^80^All^Icecrown^Vaelen the Flayed^Vaelen the Flayed^Get the Key^Honor Challenge^^Vaelen the Flayed at Ufrang's Hall has asked you to retrieve the Key to Vaelen's Chains.^<class>
column2: the key to my shackles is hanging around the neck of Instructor Hroegar outside. Perhaps you could retrieve it by separating his head from his shoulders?

column1: Let the Baron Know^80^All^Icecrown^Vaelen the Flayed^Baron Sliver^Get the Key^^^Speak with Baron Sliver at The Shadow Vault.^The most important thing that you can do right now is to return to The Shadow Vault and let Baron Sliver know that I've failed. You see
column2: I wasn't the only one captured by these vrykul devils. My entire contingent of death knights was also taken. I should have seen the trap before it was sprung
column3: but there's no use crying over spilled milk now is there? Go on before you get captured
column4: too! I'll see you back at the vault.

column1: Gem Perfection^65^Horde^Jewelcrafting^Carter Tiffens^Carter Tiffens^^^^Return two Huge Citrines
column2: two Dark Jade and two Shadow Crystals to Carter Tiffens in Vengeance Landing.^My skills are going to waste in this wretched place. I spent many years learning to cut gems into their perfect form and have nothing to work on! You look like the type who may be able to find me some gems and if you do I can teach you the skill of gem perfection. This will allow you to sometimes cut a perfect gem with increased bonuses when cutting a uncommon quality gem from Northrend.

column1: Valkyrion Must Burn^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Harpoon Crate^Iva the Vengeful^^^^Use the Valkyrion Harpoon Guns to burn 6 Dry Haystacks.^The crate is filled with incendiary harpoons. You recall seeing harpoon guns and dry stacks of hay outside. Perhaps Iva will appreciate the extra effort and reward you appropriately.

The Amphitheater of Anguish: Yggdras!^77^All^Zul'Drak^Gurgthock^Wodin the Troll-Servant^^The Ring of Blood: The Final Challenge^^Get in the arena at the Amphitheater of Anguish and defeat Yggdras! Return to Wodin the Troll-Servant to redeem your reward.^I was wondering when you'd show up
column2: <name>! Having a past champion of the Ring of Blood here will be a huge draw! We're gonna be rich
column3: buddy! RICH! Anyway
column4: this dump is Zul'Drak. All the ice trolls seem to use it as a toilet. I dunno
column5: the whole place is off its rocker if you ask me! Who cares
column6: though
column7: right? We're here to make some gold! You know the drill
column8: <name>. When you're ready let me know and we'll get this show on the road!

column1: Eliminate the Competition^80^All^Icecrown^The Leaper^The Leaper^Eliminate the Competition^The Duke^^The Leaper at The Shadow Vault wants you to duel and defeat Sigrid Iceborn
column2: Efrem the Faithful
column3: Onu'zun and Tinky Wickwhistle.^Mrrfrmrfrrmrrr... <The Leaper clears his throat.> Sorry about that. It can sometimes be hard to understand what I'm saying. You know how it is. I wanted to make sure that if you find yourself at the Savage Ledge
column4: over the mountains to the west
column5: that you make sure to eliminate the competition there. Specifically
column6: I'd like you to challenge to duels and humiliate Sigrid Iceborn
column7: Efrem the Faithful
column8: Onu'zun
column9: and Tinky Wickwhistle in front of the vrykul.

column1: A Spark of Hope^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Fjorn's Anvil^Thorim^The Refiner's Fire^^Forging an Alliance^You are to bring the Refined Gleaming Ore to Thorim in the Temple of Storms.^Clearly
column2: this is more than an ordinary hunk of metal. Unlike any ore you're familiar with
column3: it is hard but not brittle
column4: far lighter than it looks
column5: and glows even when cool. Looking closer
column6: you can make out one of Thorim's runes shining beneath the surface....

column1: Slaves of the Stormforged^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^^Fighting Back^The Gifts of Loken
column2: Facing the Storm^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper at Bouldercrag's Refuge wants you to free 6 Captive Mechagnomes and kill 3 Stormforged Taskmasters.^To the southwest
column3: on the western side of the Snowdrift Plains
column4: the iron dwarves have dug a mine into the hillside. There
column5: they use captive mechagnomes
column6: servants of Keeper Mimir
column7: to mine ore. I don't know where these mechagnomes came from
column8: nor what they would do with their freedom
column9: but perhaps we can win their help. Go to the Frozen Mine
column10: <name>
column11: and set these creatures free from their bondage. Ask if they would fight alongside us against iron dwarf tyranny.

column1: Shipment: Blood Jade Amulet^65^All^Jewelcrafting^Timothy Jones^Timothy Jones^^Finish the Shipment^^Combine a Vrykul Amulet
column2: a Dark Jade and a Bloodstone to make a Blood Jade Amulet and bring it to Timothy Jones in Dalaran.^A wealthy shipping concern has requested a collection of Blood Jade Amulets to sell at Undermine. If you can bring me one
column3: I can reward you with a Dalaran Jewelcrafter's Token.

column1: Shipment: Glowing Ivory Figurine^65^All^Jewelcrafting^Timothy Jones^Timothy Jones^^Finish the Shipment^^Combine Northern Ivory
column2: a Chalcedony and a Shadow Crystal to create a Glowing Ivory Figurine and bring it to Timothy Jones in Dalaran.^A wealthy shipping concern has requested a collection of Glowing Ivory Figurines to sell at Undermine. If you can bring me one
column3: I can reward you with a Dalaran Jewelcrafter's Token.

column1: Shipment: Wicked Sun Brooch^65^All^Jewelcrafting^Timothy Jones^Timothy Jones^^Finish the Shipment^^Combine an Iron Dwarf Brooch
column2: a Huge Citrine and a Sun Crystal to create a Wicked Sun Brooch and bring it to Timothy Jones in Dalaran.^A wealthy shipping concern has requested a collection of Wicked Sun Brooches to sell at Undermine. If you can bring me one
column3: I can reward you with a Dalaran Jewelcrafter's Token.

column1: Shipment: Intricate Bone Figurine^65^All^Jewelcrafting^Timothy Jones^Timothy Jones^^Finish the Shipment^^Combine a Proto Dragon Bone
column2: a Sun Crystal and a Dark Jade to craft an Intricate Bone Figurine and bring it to Timothy Jones in Dalaran.^A wealthy shipping concern has requested a collection of Intricate Bone Figurines to sell at Undermine. If you can bring me one
column3: I can reward you with a Dalaran Jewelcrafter's Token.

column1: Shipment: Bright Armor Relic^65^All^Jewelcrafting^Timothy Jones^Timothy Jones^^Finish the Shipment^^Combine an Elemental Armor Scrap
column2: a Bloodstone and a Huge Citrine to craft a Bright Armor Relic and bring it to Timothy Jones in Dalaran.^A wealthy shipping concern has requested a collection of Bright Armor Relics to sell at Undermine. If you can bring me one
column3: I can reward you with a Dalaran Jewelcrafter's Token.

column1: Shipment: Shifting Sun Curio^65^All^Jewelcrafting^Timothy Jones^Timothy Jones^^Finish the Shipment^^Combine a Scourge Curio
column2: a Sun Crystal and a Shadow Crystal to make a Shifting Sun Curio and bring it to Timothy Jones in Dalaran.^A wealthy shipping concern has requested a collection of Shifting Sun Curios to sell at Undermine. If you can bring me one
column3: I can reward you with a Dalaran Jewelcrafter's Token.

column1: The Dark Ore^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^^Fighting Back^^Bring 5 Ore Samples to Bouldercrag the Rockshaper at Bouldercrag's Refuge.^At the Frozen Mine in the western part of the Snowdrift Plains
column2: the stormforged iron dwarves have constructed a mine manned by slaves. It's well behind the lines
column3: so we haven't been able to find out much about what's going on there
column4: but my scouts have reported seeing them remove cartloads of dark
column5: sickly looking ore.

column1: The Gifts of Loken^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^^Slaves of the Stormforged^^Destroy Loken's Fury
column2: Loken's Power
column3: and Loken's Favor
column4: and return to Bouldercrag the Rockshaper at Bouldercrag's Refuge.^The one who commands the stormforged iron dwarves is called Runeseer Valduran. Although I have never seen them
column5: it is said that his master
column6: Keeper Loken
column7: who took over Ulduar
column8: has given Valduran powerful titan artifacts. It could explain the strength and ferocity my men see in the stormforged warriors. Valduran's base
column9: Nidavelir
column10: lies to the southwest
column11: across the Snowdrift Plains. Go there
column12: <name>
column13: and neutralize his power. Destroy these gifts of Loken's and help us to sap the strength of his followers.

column1: You Can't Miss Him^80^All^The Storm Peaks^King Jokkum^Njormeld^You Can't Miss Him^^^King Jokkum in Dun Niffelem wants you to find Njormeld at Fjorn's Anvil.^<Jokkum listens patiently to your request
column2: then ponders it carefully before responding.> So it is you we have to thank for Fjorn's demise? While it's true that you have aided us in our time of need
column3: there is still much that must be done to repair our relations with Thorim. For now
column4: I shall allow Njormeld to reforge the armor we gifted to the Stormlord so many ages ago. Consider it payment for your assistance against Fjorn. Njormeld was sent to recover Fjorn's anvil. You should find him there.

column1: Battling the Elements^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Njormeld^Njormeld^You Can't Miss Him^^Hot and Cold^Njormeld wants you to accompany Snorri to Fjorn's anvil and help him kill 10 Seething Revenants.^Snorri was once the pride of our nation. A mighty warrior
column2: many an enemy fell to his club. We honor him
column3: though he's no longer what he once was. Age has taken its toll
column4: dulling his senses and sapping his strength. Still
column5: he remains as proud as ever
column6: never missing an opportunity to join a battle. Speaking of battle
column7: we're cooling Fjorn's anvil so it can be taken home. The remaining fire revenants are putting up some resistance. Help Snorri relive his glory days
column8: <race>. Guide him against this enemy.

column1: Yulda's Folly^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Iva the Vengeful^Iva the Vengeful^^^^Iva the Vengeful at Brunnhildar Village wants you to slay Yulda the Stormspeaker in Valkyrion.^The witch that started it all
column2: Yulda the Stormspeaker came to our very village. She dared to insult our noble traditions and spouted the Lich King's venomous promises of power. She ought to have left with a sword through her
column3: but her magic was strong and she managed to escape. Seek her in Valkyrion inside the largest dwelling and show her that we are not to be trifled with.

column1: Is That Your Goblin?^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Lok'lira the Crone^Lok'lira the Crone^They Took Our Men!^^^Challenge Agnetta Tyrsdottar in order to save Zeev Fizzlespark. Return to Lok'lira the Crone in Brunnhildar Village after you've succeeded.^I trust that's the green little one you've been looking for. If I were you I'd step in before that Hyldnir splits him in half. You've arrived in the middle of the Hyldsmeet
column2: so all challenges must be accepted by participants. There's nothing to stop you from taking your green friend's place.

column1: The Hyldsmeet^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Lok'lira the Crone^Lok'lira the Crone^They Took Our Men!^^^Listen to Lok'lira the Crone's proposal.^Whether you've noticed or not
column2: by defeating your first Hyldnir in hand-to-hand combat
column3: you've entered the Hyldsmeet -- the great competition of Hyldnir against Hyldnir to determine who will rule by Thorim's side. The Hyldsmeet is the reason why I was imprisoned
column4: for I sought to partake in the competition but was far too old and frail to be a match for the Hyldnir. If you're willing to listen
column5: I've a proposal for you.

column1: Taking on All Challengers^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Lok'lira the Crone^Lok'lira the Crone^They Took Our Men!^^^Lok'lira the Crone in Brunnhildar Village wants you to defeat 6 Victorious Challengers.^Let's get you started. The good news is that by defeating Agnetta
column2: you've earned yourself a spot in the next round of matches. The bad news is that all your opponents will also have defeated someone in the first round. Do not expect pushovers.

column1: You'll Need a Bear^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Lok'lira the Crone^Brijana^They Took Our Men!^^^Speak to Brijana outside Brunnhildar Village.^You've succeeded in the first rounds of the Hyldsmeet. To advance further
column2: you're going to need a warbear of your own. Unfortunately
column3: the Hyldnir don't give them out to just anyone. You'll have to emerge victorious from true battle
column4: not just gladiatorial combat. The Hyldnir of Brunnhildar are currently involved in a feud against the Sons of Hodir
column5: Thorim's former allies. Speak to Brijana just outside the village and see how you can help them and prove yourself in the process.

column1: The Brothers Bronzebeard^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Brann Bronzebeard^Velog Icebellow^^^^Accompany Brann Bronzebeard and his flying machine to Frosthold.^That does it! We finally have the keystone... It's beautiful! I've been around the world more than once
column2: but this thing's got me all jittery with excitement again. I suppose now's not the time to stop and admire though
column3: we need to get the heck out of here. Hop on my flying machine and help keep us covered from those iron dwarves on the way out!

column1: The Champion's Call!^77^All^Zul'Drak^Shifty Vickers^Gurgthock^^^The Amphitheater of Anguish: Yggdras!^Seek out Gurgthock at the Amphitheater of Anguish in Zul'Drak.^Pfft
column2: what happens down here ain't fightin'. It's a couple of guys dancin' around a flag. You lookin' for some real action
column3: buddy? 'Cause if you are I got the hottest ticket in town. Ever heard of Gurgthock and Wodin? Goblin and troll who ran the Ring of Blood back in Outland? Well they're here in Northrend and they've started up a whole new fight club over in Zul'Drak. If you're interested go to Zul'Drak
column4: east of Crystalsong. They're at the big arena in the center. Tell 'em Shifty sent ya!

column1: In Memoriam^80^All^The Storm Peaks^King Jokkum^King Jokkum^In Memoriam^^^King Jokkum in Dun Niffelem wants you to collect 8 Horn Fragments from Thunderfall.^Surely Thorim has told you of the tragedy that divides us. It was in Thunderfall
column2: northeast of here
column3: that these events unfolded. The frozen fossils there are a reminder of that dark day
column4: as are the spirits that haunt that place. If my people are to forgive Thorim
column5: something must take the place of those images. A memorial must be constructed to bring our hearts peace. Go there
column6: <race>. Collect the fragments of Hodir's Horn that was shattered that day.

column1: A Monument to the Fallen^80^All^The Storm Peaks^King Jokkum^Njormeld^In Memoriam^^Blowing Hodir's Horn^King Jokkum wants you to bring Hodir's Horn Fragments to Njormeld in Dun Niffelem.^Bring these fragments to Njormeld. He will use the pieces of that sacred relic in the construction of a mighty monument. May it soothe the pains and heal the scars my people have borne these many years. May its presence help to bring about a new age that sees us once again in glorious battle at Thorim's side. Go now
column2: <class>. Njormeld awaits you.

column1: Blowing Hodir's Horn^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Hodir's Horn^Hodir's Horn^^A Monument to the Fallen^^You are to defeat 5 Niffelem Forefathers and 5 Restless Frostborn at Thunderfall. You are then to blow Hodir's Horn over their corpses
column2: then return to Hodir's Horn in Dun Niffelem.^You have done a great service to the giants of Dun Niffelem. Without your aid
column3: this monument would not exist. As you silently ponder its significance
column4: feelings begin to flood your heart. The feelings fill your mind with thoughts and images... as well as a sense of urgency. The sensations fade and leave you with a knowledge of what you must do. The restless spirits at Thunderfall must be put to rest. As you set off
column5: you find that your hands have been filled with an ethereal horn.

column1: Facing the Storm^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Bruor Ironbane^Bruor Ironbane^^Slaves of the Stormforged^^Bruor Ironbane at Bouldercrag's Refuge wants you to kill 10 Nidavelir Stormforged. You may kill Stormforged Champions
column2: Stormforged Magi
column3: or Stormforged War Golems.^Like Bouldercrag
column4: I once served the keepers as a craftsman in Ulduar
column5: but with Loken's betrayal
column6: I turned my hammer toward our new foes. When we could spare the men
column7: I led raids on Nidavelir to relieve the pressure on our defenders
column8: but our lines are near collapse. You've proven yourself a capable combatant and a staunch ally. Perhaps you'd be willing to take up our banner and take the fight to Nidavelir
column9: the iron dwarf stronghold to the southwest
column10: across the Snowdrift Plains.

column1: Armor of Darkness^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Dark Armor Plate^Bruor Ironbane^Armor of Darkness^^^Bring 4 Dark Armor Samples to Bruor Ironbane at Bouldercrag's Refuge.^This armor plate is thick and oversized compared to the rest of the golem's defenses. A quick examination of the golem's corpse reveals that this heavier plate seems to have been bolted on as an afterthought or a crude upgrade. Why would the iron dwarves have added this redundant and mismatched armor to their war golems? Perhaps Bruor Ironbane would know if he had the chance to examine several of these plates from stormforged war golems.

The Armor's Secrets^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Bruor Ironbane^Bruor Ironbane^Armor of Darkness^^Valduran the Stormborn^Take the Dark Armor Plate to Mimir's Workshop and ask Attendant Tock to examine it. When you're finished
column2: return to Bruor Ironbane at Bouldercrag's Refuge.^The presence of that armor plate is disorienting
column3: but we need to find out all we can from it. It could be part of one of Valduran's schemes. He's dedicated an extraordinary amount of effort to mining
column4: refining
column5: smithing
column6: and testing this metal. To the east
column7: along the northern mountain face
column8: is a building called Mimir's Workshop. It hasn't been used in quite some time
column9: but if we're lucky
column10: some of its attendants are still functional. Take your armor plate there and learn what you can from it.

column1: Hot and Cold^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Fjorn's Anvil^Fjorn's Anvil^^Battling the Elements^^You are to go to Frostfield Lake
column2: kill the Brittle Revenants there and use the Essence of Ice on the Smoldering Scraps at Fjorn's Anvil. You are then to collect 6 of the Frozen Iron scraps and return to Fjorn's Anvil in Dun Niffelem.^As you stare at the anvil you relive your recent accomplishments
column3: particularly those which brought this artifact to rest here. It suddenly occurs to you that more remains to be done. To the east
column4: smoldering scraps clutter the landscape - shrapnel from the battle fought there. If they could be cooled and gathered somehow
column5: the frost giants would have an abundant supply of metal and the region would be cleared of these remnants of war.

column1: Ebon Blade Prisoners^80^All^Icecrown^Vaelen the Flayed^Vaelen the Flayed^Vaelen Has Returned^^^Vaelen the Flayed at The Shadow Vault wants you to free 8 Ebon Blade Prisoners. They can be found in the cages throughout the greater Jotunheim region.^Now that I'm back
column2: I'm certain that the baron will want me to recover my men. I can see that we're barely hanging on here. The Lich King's forces are about to break through and we won't be able to hold without my captured death knights. Can you assist me once more
column3: <name>? Go back to Jotunheim and let them out of those cages. Break the damn locks
column4: I don't care what you have to do. The vrykul likely have the keys. Just get my men free!

column1: The Last of Her Kind^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Astrid Bjornrittar^Astrid Bjornrittar^The Last of Her Kind^Making a Harness^^Astrid Bjornrittar in Brunnhildar Village wants you to rescue an Icemaw Matriarch in the Hibernal Cavern.^For as long as I can remember
column2: we've obtained our best bears from the Hibernal Cave to the east. Those times might finally be gone. The cave has been overrun by ravenous jormungar and the wild bears are all but extinct. If you were to find a surviving matriarch
column3: however
column4: I would guarantee you that she would fight better than any of these bears born in captivity. Take this harness to the Hibernal Cave and rescue a surviving matriarch. Good luck finding one.

column1: Valduran the Stormborn^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^Valduran the Stormborn^The Armor's Secrets^Destroy the Forges!
column2: Hit Them Where it Hurts^Use Bouldercrag's War Horn when you have found Valduran the Stormborn. Defeat Valduran the Stormborn and return to Bouldercrag the Rockshaper at Bouldercrag's Refuge.^We have no choice
column3: <name>. What you learned in Mimir's Workshop means that we must act before Valduran can complete and unleash his new weapon. Even now
column4: the refuge's defenders fight to buy us time to deal with Valduran the Stormborn. You must go to Nidavelir
column5: across the Snowdrift Plains to the southwest
column6: and then find and face Valduran. But you will not be alone. Bring this war horn with you and sound it as you prepare to face the leader of our enemies. Bruor and I will aid you in this battle.

column1: Forging a Head^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Njormeld^Njormeld^Forging a Head^^^Njormeld in Dun Niffelem needs you to use the Diamond Tipped Pick on the Dead Iron Giants at Frostfield Lake and return to him when you have collected 8 Stormforged Eyes.^Greetings
column2: <race>. I have a task that King Jokkum felt you would be suited for
column3: assuming you still strive to gain favor with our people. I have developed plans for another artifact
column4: one that will grant Hodir's blessing of protection to our stronghold. I have nearly all that I require for its construction. All that remains to collect are the very eyes of our fallen enemies. Take this tool
column5: and gather the eyes from the iron giant corpses that litter our fields.

column1: Fate of the Titans^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Creteus^Creteus^Aid from the Explorers' League^^^Creteus in the Foot Steppes has requested that you travel to the Temple of Invention
column2: the Temple of Winter
column3: the Temple of Life
column4: and the Temple of Order and utilize the databank to examine each area.^Norgannon's Core is not at this location. I am not sure why you seek it
column5: <race>
column6: and I am equally unsure if you truly know the purpose of that which you seek. I would like you to aid me before I consider extending my assistance. I have recently encountered knowledge of the watcher
column7: Thorim. His seat of power is contested
column8: and his fate remains to be seen. This troubles me
column9: for I do not know of the other watchers. Utilize this databank to examine their temples to the northeast and return the knowledge to me.

column1: Mounting Hodir's Helm^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Njormeld^Njormeld^Forging a Head^^Polishing the Helm^Njormeld wants you to fly to the tip of the northern ice spike in Dun Niffelem and use the Tablets of Pronouncement.^The helm is forged. Your efforts have not gone unnoticed
column2: small one. Though there remains much to do
column3: we sons of Hodir are grateful for your accomplishments. In return
column4: I offer you the opportunity to present Hodir's helm to our king and our brethren. Fly to the sparkling tip of the small ice spike in front of me and read to our people from this tablet. Enjoy the privilege
column5: <class>. Never before has an outsider been given such an honor!

column1: Destroy the Forges!^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^Valduran the Stormborn^^A Colossal Threat^Destroy the North Lightning Forge
column2: the Central Lightning Forge
column3: and the South Lightning Forge with Bouldercrag's Bombs
column4: then return to Bouldercrag the Rockshaper at Bouldercrag's Refuge.^In my folly
column5: I'd thought Valduran's project at Narvir's Cradle
column6: a large construction area to the south
column7: no more than a grotesque monument to "Keeper" Loken's cruelty. Now we know the truth
column8: that it was meant to be used as a weapon against us and our allies. We must not allow this iron colossus to reach completion
column9: <name>
column10: for it will mean the end of the refuge. Go to Narvir's Cradle
column11: find the lightning forges the stormforged artisans use
column12: and sabotage them.

column1: The Slithering Darkness^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Astrid Bjornrittar^Astrid Bjornrittar^^Making a Harness^^Astrid Bjornrittar wants you to slay 8 Ravenous Jormungar in the Hibernal Cavern east of Brunnhildar Village.^The vile jormungar have taken over most of the Hibernal Cavern. They are despicable beings... children of Loken
