column2: Thorim's scumsucker of a brother. As Thorim's servants we owe it to ourselves to kill these scum where we find them. You'll find the cavern just east of here
column3: outside the village.

column1: Hit Them Where it Hurts^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Bruor Ironbane^Bruor Ironbane^^Valduran the Stormborn^^Kill 10 Stormforged Artificers and return to Bruor Ironbane at Bouldercrag's Refuge.^Bouldercrag's got a good plan to stymie the efforts of the iron dwarves at Narvir's Cradle
column2: and I've got an idea of my own. Work on the iron colossus will come to a halt without any artisans. Narvir's Cradle is on the south side of the hill sheltering Bouldercrag's Refuge. Go there and slay any stormforged artificers in your path. They may be no different from what we once were
column3: but they build a weapon that threatens us all.

column1: Crush Dem Vrykuls!^80^All^Icecrown^Vile^Vile^Crush Dem Vrykuls!^^Vaelen Has Returned^Vile at The Shadow Vault wants you to slay any 15 vrykul in the greater Jotunheim region.^Dem vrykuls at the Jotunheim needs to be crushed! <name> crush dems good!

A Colossal Threat^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^A Colossal Threat^Destroy the Forges!^The Heart of the Storm^Retrieve the Colossus Attack Specs and Colossus Defense Specs and bring them to Bouldercrag the Rockshaper at Bouldercrag's Refuge.^You've done an excellent job of delaying the work on the iron colossus
column2: but I fear we've only made the stormforged more determined to complete the weapon. Even now
column3: they're bringing in new laborers and the overseers push them to the limit. We may not be able to keep them from bringing the colossus online
column4: after all. Return to Narvir's Cradle
column5: to the south and find the documents detailing the colossus' offensive and defensive abilities. They should be near the tents and forges on the bottom level.

column1: Spy Hunter^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Frostworg Denmother^Frostworg Denmother^^^^You must defeat 3 Stormforged Spies in the Valley of Ancient Winters.^The rapport you've developed with the inhabitants of Dun Niffelem has yielded some unexpected discoveries. For example
column2: you somehow find yourself able to understand the denmother's guttural growls and sharp quips - at least you think you do. It would seem that she senses danger outside the stronghold and wants you to do something about it. With her forepaw
column3: she removes the chain from around her neck and lets it drop at your feet. As you pick it up you notice an aged fang attached to it....

column1: Leave Our Mark^80^All^Icecrown^Baron Sliver^Baron Sliver^^Vandalizing Jotunheim^^Baron Sliver at The Shadow Vault wishes you to plant 15 Ebon Blade Banners near the corpses of vrykul found within the greater Jotunheim region.^We must attack the vrykul of Jotunheim on many levels. Brute force
column2: of course
column3: is good
column4: but I prefer a more cerebral approach. I want you to demoralize them. My men here have forged a number of banners for you. I would like for you to take and plant them near the corpses of fallen vrykul. Let the banners serve as a constant reminder to them that they face a more immediate threat than the wrath of the Lich King.

column1: The Warm-Up^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Astrid Bjornrittar^Astrid Bjornrittar^The Last of Her Kind^^^Astrid Bjornrittar in Brunnhildar Village wants you to use the Reins of the Warbear Matriarch to defeat Kirgaraak.^You've been very fortunate
column2: sister. This is a matriarch the likes of which hasn't been seen in years. A good bear won't do you much good without the skill to ride it. I'm going to have you practice some moves on Kirgaraak. He's the largest yeti we've ever managed to capture so be careful. Don't be afraid to walk away if he gives you a beating... there's a reason why we keep him chained.

column1: Into the Pit^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Astrid Bjornrittar^Astrid Bjornrittar^The Last of Her Kind^^Back to the Pit^Astrid Bjornrittar
column2: in Brunnhildar Village
column3: wants you to use the Reins of the Warbear Matriarch inside the Pit of the Fang and defeat 6 Hyldsmeet Warbears.^Besting a tethered opponent is one thing. Fighting other bear riders on equal footing is another. Head into the Pit of the Fang and use what you've learned to defeat your opponents. Good luck
column4: sister. Glory awaits
column5: should you succeed.

column1: The Heart of the Storm^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^A Colossal Threat^^^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper at Bouldercrag's Refuge wants you to travel to Uldis and try to prevent Overseer Narvir from obtaining the Heart of the Storm.^According to the documents you captured at Narvir's Cradle
column2: the iron colossus is complete except for one key component -- the Heart of the Storm. Without it
column3: the iron colossus' weapons would be much weaker than the design predicts. If we can deny Overseer Narvir the heart
column4: we could defeat the colossus! Notes on the documents you found say that the heart is in Uldis
column5: a titan facility far to the south. Its entrance is on the south side of a tall mountain overlooking the Bor's Breath River.

column1: The Bone Witch^80^All^Icecrown^The Leaper^The Bone Witch^Eliminate the Competition^^Deep in the Bowels of The Underhalls^Speak with The Bone Witch within the cave at Njorndar Village.^You remember Lady Nightswood
column2: don't you? She certainly remembers you. She's the forlorn and very angry banshee that you 'saved' when you also broke Vile and myself out from under the Lich King's dominion. The lady has gone into Jotunheim and possessed their bone witch. She intends to wreak havoc upon the vrykul from within. She has asked that you seek her out. You'll find her in the cave on the south side of Njorndar Village to the southwest within Jotunheim.

column1: Emergency Measures^79^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Bloodguard Lorga^Bloodguard Lorga^^^^Bloodguard Lorga wants you to go to the Gimorak's Den to the east and obtain 6 Worg Furs.^The cold in these mountains is brutal. We have a day or two before we burn up all the wood from the wreckage. We spotted worgs inside a cave directly east of here. I need you to find the cave and obtain some furs. It might not sound like much
column2: but it might be the difference between freezing to death and living another day. Worgs don't hunt alone
column3: so I'm giving you a flare. It should buy you some time if you find yourself outnumbered.

column1: Raising Hodir's Spear^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Lorekeeper Randvir^Lorekeeper Randvir^^^Thrusting Hodir's Spear^Lorekeeper Randvir in Dun Niffelem wants you to collect 3 Everfrost Shards from the depths of Hibernal Cavern and 3 Stoic Mammoth Hides from the Stoic Mammoths in the Valley of Ancient Winters.^The time has come
column2: little <class>. The stars have foretold of this day. I have received a vision from mighty Hodir himself
column3: revealing the secret to the creation of a great artifact. We must obey! Were we to fail in receiving this gift
column4: doom would surely follow. I call upon you to assist me in this sacred undertaking. Go across the valley
column5: deep into the Hibernal Cavern and gather everfrost shards from the icy crater there
column6: then collect hides from the mammoths outside the cavern.

column1: Gem Perfection^65^Horde^Jewelcrafting^Geba'li^Geba'li^^^^Return two Huge Citrines
column2: two Dark Jade and two Shadow Crystals to Geba'li in Warsong Hold.^Welcome to de cold
column3: mon. Dis place may not be so good for keepin' me bones warm
column4: but I have learned how to cut me de perfect gem. All I be needin' is some gems to do me work on. Bring me some gems and I be teachin' you the skill of gem perfection. Dis will allow you to sometimes cut a perfect gem with increased bonuses when cuttin' an uncommon quality gem from Northrend.

column1: Thrusting Hodir's Spear^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Hodir's Spear^Hodir's Spear^^Raising Hodir's Spear^^You are to use Hodir's Spear to challenge a Wild Wyrm in the Valley of Ancient Winters. Once in its grip
column2: you are to fight to the death.^Hodir's Spear is an icon of great prowess in battle. Its mere presence instills a deep hunger for glory in all who enter Dun Niffelem. In fact
column3: simply being near it has compelled you to test your own abilities. Scanning the horizon
column4: your vision locks on a wild wyrm as it flies nearby. It is decided. Of you and he
column5: only one shall see the next sunrise....

column1: Gem Perfection^65^Alliance^Jewelcrafting^Alestos^Alestos^^^^Return two Huge Citrines
column2: two Dark Jade and two Shadow Crystals to Alestros in Valiance Keep.^There's a war going on and we each must do our part! Mine is cutting gems and not only can I cut normal gems but I have the skill to cut perfect gems as well. If you can bring me several uncut gems to contribute to the cause
column3: I can teach you gem perfection as well. This will allow you to sometimes cut a perfect gem with increased bonuses when cutting a uncommon quality gem from Northrend.

column1: The Earthen Oath^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Thorim^Thorim^^^^Thorim
column2: at the Terrace of the Makers
column3: wants you to use the Horn of the Peaks and call on the Earthen to defeat 20 Iron Dwarves and 7 Iron Sentinels.^For years I neglected my duties
column4: giving into defeat and self-pity. Not the brave earthen
column5: however. Their oath to protect these grounds with their lives has gone unbroken. Even now
column6: they fight the corruption of iron with selflessness
column7: waiting for the moment in which the tides turn. That moment has arrived. We must rally what remains of the earthen defenders and lead them into a glorious victory. Sound the Horn of the Peaks to call them to your side and take back the Terrace of the Makers.

column1: Polishing the Helm^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Hodir's Helm^Hodir's Helm^^Mounting Hodir's Helm^^You are to enter Hibernal Cavern west of Dun Niffelem and collect 5 units of Viscous Oil from the Viscous Oils there.^As you draw near the helm
column2: you notice that the frigid environment is already taking its toll on the artifact's surface. What is now just a thin layer of ice will surely grow to envelop it entirely. Not about to let your hard efforts go to waste
column3: you resolve to scour the region in search of a solution. Just as you set off
column4: the eyes of the helm flash and an image of the nearby Hibernal Cavern enters your mind.

column1: The Iron Colossus^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^Bouldercrag the Rockshaper^A Colossal Threat^^^Use a Tamed Jormungar to defeat the Iron Colossus and return to Bouldercrag the Rockshaper at Bouldercrag's Refuge.^We have failed to prevent the completion of the iron colossus
column2: <name>
column3: which means we have no choice but to face it in battle. Bruor has devised a plan to exploit the colossus' only weakness. No matter how tough the colossus' armor is
column4: it is still vulnerable to a jormungar's acid. Take control of one using the orbs along the northern edge of the Snowdrift Plains
column5: then use it to fight the Iron Colossus on the Snowdrift Plains. If you need help controlling the creature
column6: speak to one of the nearby handlers.

column1: Scourge Tactics^78^All^Icecrown^Crusade Commander Entari^Crusade Commander Entari^Honor Above All Else^^If There Are Survivors...^Crusade Commander Entari at the Argent Vanguard in Icecrown has asked that you free 8 Webbed Crusaders.^We had the element of surprise on our side! We blew a hole in the side of the mountain and charged into Scourgeholme. Scourge opposition was fierce and it wasn't long until we were overwhelmed. We fell back to the valley and began raining artillery down on the Scourge that followed. This held them back for awhile until... Those monsters began using crusaders as living shields. We had to stop shelling for fear of killing our own soldiers. Free our crusaders trapped on the field outside the base
column2: <class>!

column1: A New Beginning^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Njormeld^Thorim^Forging an Alliance^^^Njormeld wants you to take the Reforged Armor to Thorim at the Temple of Storms.^It remains uncertain whether or not our people can ever rekindle the affection we once held for Thorim. May this armor
column2: if nothing else
column3: remind him of the days when we stood together in honor
column4: invincible.

column1: Krolmir
column2: Hammer of Storms^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Thorim^Thorim^Forging an Alliance^^^Thorim wants you to talk to King Jokkum in Dun Niffelem and discover what he knows of Krolmir.^One task remains before I can reclaim my home at the Terrace of the Makers. Krolmir must be found. On that fateful day
column3: I threw it to the earth with all the power and rage I possessed. A mighty explosion followed. I've thought it lost for these many years
column4: but now I must be certain. Return to King Jokkum and discover what
column5: if anything
column6: he knows of my hammer's fate.

column1: Jormuttar is Soo Fat...^80^All^The Storm Peaks^King Jokkum^King Jokkum^^^^King Jokkum in Dun Niffelem wants you to slay Jormuttar in Hibernal Cavern.^I have an opportunity that will help you to gain approval with my people
column2: provided you prevail. The jormungar are a nuisance best dealt with quickly. If given any quarter
column3: they breed like hares and spread like fire. They have appeared southwest of here
column4: in the Hibernal Cavern. If their spawnmother is not slain soon
column5: they will gain a foothold in our region. She cannot refuse food. Take this knife and get the flank of a bear corpse from their cave. Place it near her crater and kill her as she feeds.

column1: The Witness and the Hero^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Xarantaur^Xarantaur^Xarantaur
column2: the Witness^^^Xarantaur
column3: at Camp Tunka'lo
column4: wants you to read the First History Scroll
column5: the Second History Scroll
column6: and the Third History Scroll.^When I began my travels in Northrend
column7: I visited the Borean Tundra and met the taunka for the first time. There
column8: Wind Tamer Barah told me the tale of Stormhoof and his battle against the North Wind
column9: their people's ancient enemy. I set out for the Storm Peaks to learn more of this hero
column10: but strangely
column11: the people of Tunka'lo seem to know nothing of him. Perhaps the camp's own records will give us greater insight. Find and read the history scrolls kept throughout the camp
column12: then tell me what you learned.

column1: Loken's Lackeys^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Thorim^Thorim^^^The Reckoning^Thorim wants you to slay Eisenfaust inside the Hall of the Shaper and Halefnir the Windborn and Duronn the Runeforged in the Terrace of the Makers.^The attack on the Terrace of the Makers was not a half-hearted move on my brother's behalf. He sent a legion of iron dwarves and some of his most powerful lieutenants. Use the Horn of the Peaks to call the earthen to your side and defeat Loken's servants. You'll find the giant
column2: Eisenfaust
column3: inside the Hall of the Shaper to the north. You'll find the others deeper inside the Terrace of the Makers
column4: beyond the stairs to the northwest.

column1: Honor Above All Else^78^All^Icecrown^Highlord Tirion Fordring^Crusade Commander Entari^Honor Above All Else^^Defending The Vanguard
column2: Curing The Incurable^Report to Crusade Commander Entari at the Argent Vanguard in Icecrown.^Long has been the path to our salvation
column3: young <class>. We have fought across continents
column4: worlds even
column5: to reach this point. Now we face our greatest challenge: the destruction of the Lich King and his Scourge. Alas
column6: we fight this battle divided. The Horde and Alliance are in the throes of war and will lend us no support. We must remain unyielding in our cause! For what choice have we to do otherwise? Do you join the cause? Lend us your strength
column7: <class>! My commander
column8: Entari
column9: awaits you at his post.

column1: Memories of Stormhoof^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Xarantaur^Xarantaur^^^^Speak with Chieftain Swiftspear in Frostfloe Deep
column2: then return to Xarantaur at Camp Tunka'lo.^When the bronze dragonflight gifted me with immortality and set me on the path of the witness
column3: Nozdormu entrusted me with the Lorehammer. The hammer's reaction to your findings means that time has gone awry here and it is our duty to restore the true timeline. We must find it. To the northwest is Frostfloe Deep
column4: ancient burial cave of the warriors of Tunka'lo. Seek out the spirit of Chieftain Swiftspear
column5: Stormhoof's brother. Ask him what he remembers of his brother's battle against the North Wind.

column1: Distortions in Time^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Chieftain Swiftspear^Xarantaur^^^^Use the Chieftain's Totem to close 4 Frostfloe Rifts
column2: then bring the totem to Xarantaur at Camp Tunka'lo.^This
column3: the tomb of Tunka'lo's warriors
column4: is supposed to be a serene place
column5: free from the terror of the elements. Frostfloe Deep has been invaded by a strange force
column6: one that disturbs the spirits of the fallen and blurs my memories of my own life. It's as though our deeds and memories are being erased from history. In life
column7: this totem was a symbol of my authority. It is the last true link I have to this world. Take it
column8: use it to restore calm to the tomb
column9: and then return it to Camp Tunka'lo.

column1: Defending The Vanguard^78^All^Icecrown^Crusader Lord Dalfors^Crusader Lord Dalfors^^Honor Above All Else^If There Are Survivors...^Crusader Lord Dalfors at the Argent Vanguard in Icecrown has asked that you kill 15 Forgotten Depths Nerubians.^We can't keep this pace up
column2: <lad/lass>. Once the breach was blown
column3: the floodgates opened up. The Scourge have been pourin' through ever since with no end in sight! We need every able bodied man and woman to help keep the tide of evil at bay. Get out there and do yer share
column4: friend. Kill as many of those monsters as ye can!

column1: Curing The Incurable^78^All^Icecrown^Father Gustav^Father Gustav^^Honor Above All Else^If There Are Survivors...^Father Gustav at the Argent Vanguard in Icecrown has asked that you bring him 10 Forgotten Depths Venom Sacs.^The number of injured soldiers rises with each passing day. They are being stricken by some type of toxin that we have never before seen. Whatever it is that these Nerubians hold within their venom glands is lethal and incurable! So far we've only been able to slow down the poison flowing through the victim's bodies. We must devise a cure! Venture northwest to the valley outside of the Vanguard and slay the Forgotten Depths Nerubians. Recover their venom glands and bring them to me.
Finish the Shipment^65^All^Jewelcrafting^Timothy Jones^Timothy Jones^^^Shipment: Blood Jade Amulet
column2: Shipment: Glowing Ivory Figurine
column3: Shipment: Wicked Sun Brooch
column4: Shipment: Intricate Bone Figurine
column5: Shipment: Bright Armor Relic
column6: Shipment: Shifting Sun Curio^Bring a Chalcedony to Timothy Jones in Dalaran.^I'm glad you showed up! A shipment of Glowing Ivory Figurines needs to go out to Undermine right now
column7: and I am still short a Chalcedony to complete an eye for the last one. Bring me one and a Dalaran Jeweler's token will be yours.

column1: Deep in the Bowels of The Underhalls^80^All^Icecrown^The Bone Witch^The Bone Witch^^The Bone Witch^^The Bone Witch in Njorndar Village has asked you to beat information out of Apprentice Osterkilgr concerning what Dr. Terrible is truly up to.^Deep in the bowels of The Underhalls to the northeast
column2: a mad scientist known as Dr. Terrible is up to something befitting his name. The doctor has been given dispensation by the Lich King to perform experiments upon the vargul -- the vrykul who fall in battle and are found unworthy
column3: and then turned into Scourge. We must put an end to his work
column4: but my auguries have been unable to find him. He does
column5: however
column6: have an assistant. Beat the information out of his apprentice
column7: and then dispose of the body.

column1: The Sum is Greater than the Parts^80^All^Icecrown^Dr. Terrible's "Building a Better Flesh Giant"^The Bone Witch^The Sum is Greater than the Parts^^^Mount and take control of Nergeld. Defend it from the denizens of the Hall of Horrors until Dr. Terrible shows himself.^Opening the tome
column2: you notice all manner of disgusting illustrations concerning the construction of what the doctor refers to as "the ultimate weapon"! Clearly the prototype
column3: Nergeld
column4: is the massive flesh giant standing still at the end of the nearby Hall of Horrors. If an army of those things were to be constructed
column5: then it would mean doom. The only way to ensure that doesn't happen is to slay Dr. Terrible! Perhaps if you were to take control of the construct
column6: the doctor would reveal himself?

column1: If There Are Survivors...^78^All^Icecrown^Crusade Commander Entari^Penumbrius^If There Are Survivors...^Scourge Tactics
column2: Defending The Vanguard
column3: Curing The Incurable^Into The Wild Green Yonder^Speak with Penumbrius at the Argent Vanguard in Icecrown.^Across the Valley of Echoes
column4: west of here
column5: and through the Breach
column6: is the first Scourge encampment in Icecrown known as Scourgeholme. We fought a good fight at Scourgeholme and killed many Scourge
column7: but in the end we were forced to retreat. Many soldiers were left behind - their fate unknown. If there are survivors
column8: we must attempt a rescue. Directly down this southeastern path is Penumbrius
column9: ally of the bronze dragonflight and caretaker of the proto-brood. Seek him out and ask for his assistance.

column1: Into The Wild Green Yonder^78^All^Icecrown^Penumbrius^Highlord Tirion Fordring^If There Are Survivors...^^A Cold Front Approaches^Rescue 3 Captured Argent Crusaders from Scourgeholme and drop them off at the Vanguard Infirmary at the center of the Argent Vanguard. Report to Highlord Tirion Fordring should you succeed.^We will do all that we can to assist you
column2: <name>. The proto-brood have volunteered to fly you across the Breach and into Scourgeholme. Rescue any captured Argent Crusaders that you find. Return them immediately to the Vanguard Infirmary
column3: located at the center of this base. Choose one of the Argent Skytalons in the pen behind me and go! Scourgeholme is located northwest
column4: across the Valley of Echoes
column5: through the great Breach.

column1: Feeding Arngrim^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Arngrim the Insatiable^Arngrim the Insatiable^^^^You are to feed Arngrim 5 Disembodied Jormungar
column2: then return to Arngrim's frozen image in Dun Niffelem.^Arngrim's hunger was legendary. Even in death
column3: his expression is one of famished yearning. You find that just looking at him is making your stomach growl. It is said that throughout his life he was never truly sated
column4: and that there was absolutely nothing he wouldn't eat. You wonder to yourself if there might be a way to feed the old king. No sooner does the thought enter your mind than one of the massive frozen teeth falls from Arngrim's head
column5: bounces off of his beard and lands in your hand.

column1: The Reckoning^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Thorim^King Jokkum^The Reckoning^Loken's Lackeys^Diametrically Opposed^Meet Thorim near the Temple of Wisdom. Report the outcome of the fight to King Jokkum in Dun Niffelem.^Loken killed my wife
column2: turned my followers and me against each other. He took away everything I had
column3: but today... that changes. Today we reclaim our sacred grounds. Today... Loken dies. Meet me on the bridge near the Temple of Wisdom
column4: just southwest of Ulduar. I will finish this one way or the other. I need you there as a witness. You will not aid me -- this is personal. After it's done
column5: send word to Jokkum
column6: King of the Frost Giants. He's a good friend and will know what to do.

column1: Where Time Went Wrong^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Xarantaur^Xarantaur^^^^Use the Lorehammer on Taunka Relics to attune it to the time of Stormhoof. Once it has been attuned to 6 relics from the time of Stormhoof
column2: return to Xarantaur at Camp Tunka'lo.^The Lorehammer can help us correct the damage to the timeline
column3: but only if we can discover where the history was originally corrupted. From Chieftain Swiftspear and your findings at Frostfloe Deep
column4: we know that the change happened around the time of Stormhoof's death. Now
column5: you must go to the Howling Hollow
column6: north of the camp
column7: and inspect the gravesites the North Wind's minions have already destroyed. The Lorehammer will react to artifacts from Stormhoof's era and attune itself to the proper time.

column1: The Hero's Arms^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Xarantaur^Xarantaur^^^^Recover Stormhoof's Spear and Stormhoof's Mail and return them to Xarantaur at Camp Tunka'lo.^Not all of the camp's records have yet been corrupted. My staff has helped me to find those records which reflect the true timeline. They agree that Stormhoof was given a burial of honor among the village elders on the bottom level of the Howling Hollow
column2: to the north. Most of the graves there have already been destroyed
column3: their contents taken as trophies by the North Wind's subjects. Go to the hollow and see if you can recover Stormhoof's spear and armor from the scions of storm who have claimed them.

column1: Veranus^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Thorim^Thorim^Forging an Alliance^^^Thorim
column2: at the Temple of Storms
column3: wants you to obtain 5 Small Proto-Drake Eggs from the peaks near Brunnhildar Village.^If I'm to launch an attack against my brother's army
column4: I'm going to need some way to get around. I released my riding drake back into the wild years ago. Veranus was magnificent. The leader of her own brood -- to whom she has now returned. Finding her will be hard
column5: but perhaps there's a way. She keeps her old empty nest out of pure pride. She's a broodmother in name only
column6: for she is beyond the age of breeding. Bring me small eggs from the other nests near Brunnhildar. I think I've an idea.

column1: Territorial Trespass^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Thorim^Thorim^Forging an Alliance^^^Place the Stolen Proto-Dragon Eggs on top of the Broodmother's Nest and return to Thorim at the Temple of Storms.^Veranus is proud like no other beast I've known. She still keeps her old nest and makes sure none of the younger proto-drakes takes it over. Take the eggs you've collected and place them on her nest. You'll find it atop a small peak
column2: directly southeast of here. I should be able to get control of her before she kills you in a fit of rage. Hopefully.

column1: The Missing Tracker^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Bloodguard Lorga^Tracker Val'zij^The Missing Tracker^^^Look for Tracker Val'zij inside Gimorak's Den
column2: southeast of the Grom'arsh Crash Site.^I can't in good conscience send you to the worg cave without warning you that the previous person we sent there hasn't returned. We're prepared for the worst
column3: but perhaps there's a chance that he's alive. We'd appreciate it if you helped him return -- Tracker Val'zij is one of the only hunters we have.

column1: Cave Medicine^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Tracker Val'zij^Tracker Val'zij^The Missing Tracker^^^Tracker Val'zij
column2: at Gimorak's Den
column3: wants you to obtain 1 Jormungar Toxin Gland and 8 Cave Mushrooms.^It's good to see a friendly face. Might be the last one I see. One of those jormungar stung me with some sort of toxin before I managed to get away. I can feel my whole body getting numb
column4: mon. I'm going to need a toxin gland to make an antidote. I will also need some of the cave mushrooms that grow here... they'll slow the toxin down. Hurry
column5: please. I don't have much time.

column1: There's Always Time for Revenge^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Tracker Val'zij^Tracker Val'zij^The Missing Tracker^^^Tracker Val'zij wants you to slay Gimorak inside Gimorak's Den.^I should manage for now
column2: <name>. There is one favor I'd like to ask
column3: though. I would never had fallen to one of these worms
column4: but my wind serpent
column5: Heesha
column6: was killed by the meanest worg I've seen in some time. Don't worry about me now
column7: I'll feel better when that worg is breathing no more. You should find him deeper in the cave.

column1: The Terrace of the Makers^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Thorim^Thorim^Forging an Alliance^^^Find Thorim at the southeastern edge of the Terrace of the Makers
column2: just northwest of Dun Niffelem.^It is time
column3: <name>. I am prepared to face Loken now. Let us make our way to the Terrace of the Makers and face my brother's forces. The fool will regret ever crossing me.

column1: Changing the Wind's Course^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Xarantaur^Xarantaur^^^^Use the Lorehammer to travel back in time and face the North Wind as Stormhoof. When Stormhoof falls and drops the Horn of Elemental Fury
column2: use it to finish off the North Wind
column3: and then return to Xarantaur at Camp Tunka'lo.^At last
column4: we have all that we need to right the wrongs of the North Wind and its followers. You have attuned the Lorehammer to Stormhoof's time and his persona. Take the hammer again
column5: head to the Temple of Life in the plains to the northwest. Use the hammer to assume the role of Stormhoof. Face the North Wind as Stormhoof
column6: but realize that for the timeline to be restored
column7: Stormhoof must die as the North Wind weakens. Then
column8: you must find and use the Horn of Elemental Fury to destroy the North Wind.

column1: Revenge for the Vargul^80^All^Icecrown^Bethod Feigr^Bethod Feigr^^^^Bethod Feigr in The Underhalls wants you to throw down his sword to challenge Thane Illskar and then kill him in The Circle of Suffering.^I've been praying to The Lady of the Sword for one to come and strike down my enemy. Thane Illskar must pay for what he did to me! I was the champion of Thane Ufrang the Mighty. During my fight for ascendance in Valhalas
column2: Illskar sabotaged me with dark magic
column3: causing me to lose and be reduced to this. The thane and his champions can be found below in The Circle of Suffering. Challenge him on my behalf. Defeat him. Make him know the suffering that I know!

column1: When All Else Fails^78^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Ricket^Olut Alegut^^Demolitionist Extraordinaire^^Speak to Ricket to make use of Ricket's D16 Propelled Delivery Device to enter further into Storm Peaks.^So... so I don't think we're going to be getting a good foothold in those mountains. Trust me
column2: I'm not one to give up easily... but between freezing engines
column3: nasty vrykul women
column4: territorial dragon want-to-bes and the half a dozen other nasties settled in the area
column5: this just ain't happening. Don't let that dissuade you though! Just because we can't get a foothold doesn't mean we won't get you there... one-way trips are pretty simple when you get down to it. <Ricket nods at some nearby rockets.>

column1: Prepare for Glory^79^All^The Storm Peaks^Astrid Bjornrittar^Lok'lira the Crone^The Last of Her Kind^^^Speak to Lok'lira the Crone in Brunnhildar Village.^This is it then. I'll take care of your bear now
column2: you won't be needing her. The great Drakkensryd will be your next challenge. Say goodbye to your friends and leave your affairs in order
column3: for you will return victorious... or you won't return at all.

column1: Lok'lira's Parting Gift^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Lok'lira the Crone^Gretta the Arbiter^The Last of Her Kind^^^Speak to Gretta the Arbiter in Brunnhildar Village.^You've been a great ally
column2: <name>. Now comes your true test. You will need skill
column3: courage and a little luck. <Lok'lira attaches a thin strand of hair to yours.> You cannot fail now sister. Speak to Gretta the Arbiter. She'll see you on your way.

column1: Deemed Worthy^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Brijana^Astrid Bjornrittar^They Took Our Men!^^^Brijana wants you to go to Brunnhildar Village and speak with Astrid Bjornrittar.^You have succeeded where many have failed
column2: sister. Whether it be by strength and courage or mere luck remains to be seen. Go back to the village and seek out Astrid Bjornrittar. Tell her of your accomplishments. But be warned. She is not easily impressed.

column1: Sibling Rivalry^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Thorim^Thorim^The Last of Her Kind^^^Thorim wants you to listen to his story.^Sif? Is it truly you? No? A <race>? But for a moment.... Enough of this! The visions of my Sif have tormented me for far too long. It is time for me to avenge her
column2: and to bring honor to her memory. My brother must pay!

column1: A Tale of Valor^80^All^Icecrown^Highlord Tirion Fordring^Crusader Bridenbrad^A Tale of Valor^^^Highlord Tirion Fordring at Crusaders' Pinnacle has requested that you locate the hero
column2: Crusader Bridenbrad at the Silent Vigil
column3: in northeast Icecrown. His fire pit will likely be the most obvious indication of his location from the air.^Perhaps you've heard the praises for our missing hero? Crusader Bridenbrad was in the Broken Front aiding the attack against the Scourge when the undead army came down upon them. The many men of that allied force scattered
column4: but Bridenbrad alone returned and dragged more than a dozen men to safety
column5: one by one through the carnage. <class>
column6: he has not returned since. He was spotted heading to the far northeast
column7: towards the Silent Vigil. Bring him back to me that I might honor him for his valor.

column1: Shoot 'Em Up^80^All^Icecrown^The Leaper^The Leaper^^^^The Leaper at The Shadow Vault wants you to use a Jotunheim Rapid-Fire Harpoon to shoot down 15 Jotunheim Proto-Drakes and their riders.^Jotunheim has aerial defenses
column2: both in terms of proto-drake riders and harpoon guns. They've concentrated these on their northern and western facings where they are most vulnerable. Let's use their defenses against them! <The Leaper pierces you with his single eye and cackles maniacally.> Take control of a harpoon gun on the platforms that overhang the cliffs on either side of Valhalas to the southwest. Take out the proto-drakes and their riders. Shoot 'em up!

column1: A Cold Front Approaches^78^All^Icecrown^Highlord Tirion Fordring^Siegemaster Fezzik^If There Are Survivors...^^The Last Line Of Defense^Report to Siegemaster Fezzik at the Argent Vanguard in Icecrown.^The chill of death stirs in the west
column2: threatening to freeze our hearts and souls to this wasteland and bind us to its dark master. We will stand and we will fight! The preparations have begun. Report to Siegemaster Fezzik at the front gate for your assignment.

column1: Vile Like Fire!^80^All^Icecrown^Vile^Vile^Crush Dem Vrykuls!^^^Vile at The Shadow Vault wants you to steal a Njorndar Proto-Drake and use it to set fire to 8 vrykul buildings in the greater Jotunheim region.^Vile like fire! Vile like proto-drakes! <The abomination claps its hands excitedly.> Little <name> go to Jotunheim and steal a pretty proto-drake in Njorndar Village. Make proto-drake make pretty fires on Jotunheim buildings!

A Hero Remains^80^All^Icecrown^Crusader Bridenbrad^Highlord Tirion Fordring^A Tale of Valor^^^Bring news of Crusader Bridenbrad's fate to Highlord Tirion Fordring at Crusaders' Pinnacle.^I know why you've come... they've sent you to bring me back
column2: but that cannot happen. I carry the plague of undeath
column3: <class>
column4: and I'll not share my fate with those near me. No
column5: I shall stay here. My only regret lies in what I may become when death grips me. I do not fear death itself
column6: but I loathe to consider serving the traitor
column7: Arthas. Leave me... and see to it that no one else comes looking. You would do me a great disservice if you were to expose anyone to the plague that I carry.

column1: The Keeper's Favor^80^All^Icecrown^Highlord Tirion Fordring^Keeper Remulos^A Tale of Valor^^^Highlord Tirion Fordring at Crusaders' Pinnacle has requested that you secure passage from Arch Druid Lilliandra and speak to Keeper Remulos in Moonglade.^There are those of this world that tap into power unrestricted by the bounds of our mortal frames - powers of restoration
column2: powers of life
column3: and powers of light. And Bridenbrad
column4: this is no ordinary man... his valor and devotion shine through. We can only hope that one of these beings will intervene and bring this hero back from a fate worse than death. Go now and speak to Arch Druid Lilliandra in the Argent Vanguard... request passage to Moonglade and seek the aid of Keeper Remulos.

column1: Hope Within the Emerald Nightmare^80^All^Icecrown^Keeper Remulos^Keeper Remulos^A Tale of Valor^^^Keeper Remulos at Moonglade has instructed you to enter the emerald dream and recover 3 Emerald Acorns.^What we need exists only in the emerald dream... acorns that are infused with a powerful restorative magic. Many places in this sacred glade are closely tied with the dream
column2: and my shrine is among them. I will send you into the dream to recover some of these acorns. Be prepared though <class>
column3: for this method of entering the dream is dangerous
column4: and it is very likely you will be beset by nightmares. Recover a few acorns quickly
column5: and then depart from my shrine or pinch yourself to return to our world.

column1: The Boon of Remulos^80^All^Icecrown^Keeper Remulos^Crusader Bridenbrad^A Tale of Valor^^Time Yet Remains^Return to Crusader Bridenbrad at the Silent Vigil in Icecrown with the Emerald Acorn.^I shall open a portal to take you back to the druid that brought you here. You and your crusader have my well wishes. I hope that this acorn is able to purify your crusader and save him from the wretched fate of the plague. Farewell
column2: <race>.

column1: Time Yet Remains^80^All^Icecrown^Crusader Bridenbrad^Highlord Tirion Fordring^Time Yet Remains^The Boon of Remulos^^Return to Highlord Tirion Fordring at Crusaders' Pinnacle with news of Emerald Acorn's effects.^I feel refreshed... renewed... but the plague still grips me. Not to worry
column2: I am still eternally grateful that you went to such lengths for me
column3: a complete stranger. If nothing else
column4: you've bought me a few more precious hours not plaguing the world as a hideous undead. Thank you
column5: <class>. Please extend my thanks to Tirion as well
column6: and let him know that it has been an honor to serve beside him.

column1: The Touch of an Aspect^80^All^Icecrown^Highlord Tirion Fordring^Alexstrasza the Life-Binder^Time Yet Remains^^^Request the aid of Alexstrasza the Life-Binder at Wyrmrest Temple.^The dragon-queen
column2: Alexstrasza
column3: possesses magics over all life. In the past
column4: she has used great fire to incinerate undead and rebirth fresh new life in their place. Perhaps her powers might be able to save our Bridenbrad as well. Alexstrasza makes her home at Wyrmrest Temple in Dragonblight - please go to her and humbly request her aid on my behalf.

column1: Dahlia's Tears^80^All^Dragonblight^Alexstrasza the Life-Binder^Alexstrasza the Life-Binder^Time Yet Remains^^^Alexstrasza the Life-Binder at Wyrmrest Temple has requested that you recover Dahlia's Tears from soil freshly cleansed by a Ruby Keeper's flames.^In this dark time
column2: I'll not be the one to abandon a champion of the Light. We will need something sacred for this to have a hope of saving your Bridenbrad... a remnant of a devout being that fell victim to this very same plague. Go now to the sacred soil of the passages outside my Ruby Dragonshrine where the battle is joined. As my Ruby Keepers fly down and set flame to the ground beneath undead feet
column3: you will witness new life grow forth. Among that life are Dahlia's Tears - bring them to me.

column1: The Boon of Alexstrasza^80^All^Icecrown^Alexstrasza the Life-Binder^Crusader Bridenbrad^Time Yet Remains^^Hope Yet Remains^Bring the Breath of Alexstrasza to Crusader Bridenbrad at the Silent Vigil in Icecrown.^You must understand
column2: young <race>
column3: that cleansing the body in favor of life anew is something well within my grasp... removing the plague of undeath without affecting the body
column4: however
column5: is beyond the scope of the powers that I control. If this Bridenbrad is the beacon of light that you profess him to be
column6: perhaps he will endure such a cleansing and thrive
column7: but I cannot state with confidence that this is the salvation that you seek. Take it and go with all of my blessings.

column1: Hope Yet Remains^80^All^Icecrown^Crusader Bridenbrad^Highlord Tirion Fordring^Hope Yet Remains^The Boon of Alexstrasza^^Return to Highlord Tirion Fordring at Crusaders' Pinnacle with news of the effects of the Breath of Alexstrasza.^<Bridenbrad raises a hand to you as he catches his breath.> It was nearly as painful as it looked
column2: but it was as if I could feel some of the corruption being burnt away from within my body. It seems the plague is not so readily bested though. <class>
column3: thank you for everything that you have done. Your selfless actions have renewed my hope that there is yet great good left within this world - I can depart without fear that darkness will prevail in my absence. Go now
column4: go with no regrets.

column1: The Will of the Naaru^80^All^Icecrown^Highlord Tirion Fordring^A'dal^Hope Yet Remains^^^Request the aid of A'dal at Shattrath City in Terokkar Forest.^I appreciate everything that you have done for us
column2: <name>. I have one last errand for you... one last gleaming hope for a paladin who deserves any salvation that we can extend. Go now to Shattrath and speak to the naaru
column3: A'dal. He has long been a beacon of light and powerful ally to devout paladins. Impart Bridenbrad's story and seek any aid that he might have to offer. I cannot impress how important it is that you move quickly - I fear our crusader does not have much more time in this world.

column1: The Boon of A'dal^80^All^Icecrown^A'dal^Crusader Bridenbrad^Hope Yet Remains^^Light Within the Darkness^Return to Crusader Bridenbrad at the Silent Vigil in Icecrown.^I am pleased that you have come to me
column2: <name>. I know of Crusader Bridenbrad
column3: and of your travels in hope of saving him. Bridenbrad's valor has sparked remarkable selflessness in you
column4: and this is a miracle unto itself. The Light will take care of its own. I will extend my blessing to Bridenbrad and he shall not endure the corruption of undeath. I shall return you to Dalaran
column5: and you shall return to him. Know that I remain with you.

column1: Light Within the Darkness^80^All^Icecrown^Bridenbrad's Possessions^Highlord Tirion Fordring^^The Boon of A'dal^^Bring Crusader Bridenbrad's Tabard to Highlord Tirion Fordring at Crusaders' Pinnacle.^<Crusader Bridenbrad's tabard rests in the bottom of the chest
column2: shifting slightly as the howling wind finds its way in.> Tirion will desire this last remnant of the great crusader.

column1: Vandalizing Jotunheim^80^All^Icecrown^Duke Lankral^Duke Lankral^^^Leave Our Mark
column2: Vaelen Has Returned^Duke Lankral at The Shadow Vault wants you to burn 10 Vrykul Banners.^Let us see if we can further weaken the resolve of the vrykul
column3: <name>. Each day I wish you to travel to Jotunheim and put their banners to the torch. It may seem a trivial thing
column4: but to see their ancestral home vandalized on a daily basis will demoralize them more than any physical punishment you can inflict. At least... it can't hurt.

column1: Vaelen Has Returned^80^All^Icecrown^Baron Sliver^Vaelen the Flayed^Vaelen Has Returned^Crush Dem Vrykuls!
column2: Vandalizing Jotunheim^^Speak with Vaelen the Flayed at The Shadow Vault.^I just saw that incompetent fool
column3: Vaelen the Flayed
column4: sneak into the vault building. Go see to it that he rectifies his mistake and returns my death knights to me!

column1: The Last Line Of Defense^78^All^Icecrown^Siegemaster Fezzik^Siegemaster Fezzik^If There Are Survivors...^^Once More Unto The Breach
column2: Hero
column3: Once More Unto The Breach
column4: Hero^Use an Argent Cannon to destroy 100 Scourge attackers. You must also kill 3 Frostbrood Destroyers.^I've triggered the base's defenses
column5: <class>! Atop each of the Vanguard's four towers is a retractable Argent Crusade cannon
column6: blessed by Father Gustav himself. You'll need to fly up to one of those towers and man a cannon. Use it to destroy the Scourge onslaught that the Lich King has deployed. Just one warning
column7: the Scourge will undoubtedly send their frost wyrms to lay siege to the towers. Shoot them out of the sky! If they destroy the walls and towers of this base
column8: we're done for!

column1: Northern Cooking^65^Alliance^Cooking^Brom Brewbaster^Brom Brewbaster^^^^Bring four chilled meat to Brom Brewbaster at Valgarde. Chilled meat can be found on any Northrend beast.^So what are ya doin' if you dinna have any stew for me. I got me a HUNGER! At least bring me some chilled meat so I kin cook me own stew! If ya do
column2: I kin give ya the recipe so you kin make it for yourself. NOW GO GET ME SOME MEAT!

column1: Northern Cooking^65^Alliance^Cooking^Rollick MacKreel^Rollick MacKreel^^^^Bring four chilled meat to Rollick Mackreel at Valiance Keep. Chilled meat can be found on any Northrend beast.^We got a lot of new recruits here and these lads are hungry! If you could go out and get me some chilled meat for stew
column2: I could teach you how to make it for yourself.

column1: Northern Cooking^65^Horde^Cooking^Thomas Kolichio^Thomas Kolichio^^^^Bring four chilled meat to Thomas Kolichio at Vengeance Landing. Chilled meat can be found on any Northrend beast.^Nothing like a stew made from the living to warm your bones. Bring me some of the chilled meat that can be found on the wretched beasts of this place
column2: and I shall teach you to make a warm stew.

column1: Northern Cooking^65^Horde^Cooking^Orn Tenderhoof^Orn Tenderhoof^^^^Bring four chilled meat to Orn Tenderhoof at Warsong Hold. Chilled meat can be found on any Northrend beast.^The warriors of the Warsong Offensive need food in their bellies to keep their strength up. If you could bring some chilled meats from the Rhinos or other beasts
column2: I could make them some stew. I would be willing to teach you the recipe if you were willing.

column1: The Art of Being a Water Terror^80^All^Icecrown^The Bone Witch^The Bone Witch^The Sum is Greater than the Parts^^^The Bone Witch in Njorndar Village wants you to possess a Water Terror and use it to slay 10 vrykul in the greater Jotunheim region.^The water lock outside my cave is teeming with elementals that the vrykul magi have yet to tame. I am going to teach you a trick for possessing these creatures for a short time
column2: and you will use them to wreak havoc upon Jotunheim! <The banshee-infested vrykul draws magic in the air and touches a large finger to your forehead.> Go now and open the gate to the lock. A water terror will rush out and you will possess it to destroy our enemies!

column1: Reading the Bones^80^All^Icecrown^The Bone Witch^The Bone Witch^^^Reading the Bones^The Bone Witch in Njorndar Village has instructed you to collect 15 Vrykul Bones.^One of the benefits of possessing this creature is that I have access to all of her powers. As a bone witch and rune reader
column2: she has the power to throw the bones and determine one's fate. <The Bone Witch smirks.> Lucky for you and I that I have it within my power to influence those readings. Bring me the bones of the vrykul that you kill here in Jotunheim and I will toss them to allow you to determine your own fate.

column1: Have They No Shame?^71^Alliance^Borean Tundra^Librarian Serrah^Librarian Serrah^^^^Librarian Serrah wants you to enter the Nexus and recover Berinand's Research.^Archmage Berinand is the Kirin Tor's foremost authority on Malygos. He's spent his life studying the aspect and his behaviors. Recently
column2: he loaned me his research on the Arcanomicron
column3: some sort of map that Malygos is trying to assemble. I made the mistake of discussing it with a group of Horde adventurers while they were restocking their goods here - and now it's gone! It must have been them
column4: <class>. Please
column5: follow them into the nexus and recover the book before Berinand comes to recover it.

column1: Have They No Shame?^71^Horde^Borean Tundra^Librarian Serrah^Librarian Serrah^^^^Librarian Serrah wants you to enter the Nexus and recover Berinand's Research.^Archmage Berinand is the Kirin Tor's foremost authority on Malygos. He's spent his life studying the aspect and his behaviors. Recently
column2: he loaned me his research on the Arcanomicron
column3: some sort of map that Malygos is trying to assemble. I made the mistake of discussing it with a group of Alliance adventurers while they were restocking their goods here - and now it's gone! It must have been them
column4: <class>. Please
column5: follow them into the nexus and find the book before Berinand comes to recover it from me.

column1: Gal'darah Must Pay^78^All^Zul'Drak^Tol'mar^Tol'mar^Unfinished Business^^^Tol'mar at Dubra'Jin wants you to slay Gal'darah in Gundrak.^Did ya see it
column2: mon? It musta been da most awful thing I ever seen. Da great Akali - slain right before my eyes. Horrible... I done took an oath not ta be gettin' involved here. My job be to observe only. But dis cannot stand! Gal'darah must pay! Go into Gundrak and seek him out. Come back to me when Akali's death been avenged
column3: mon.

column1: Unfinished Business^78^All^Zul'Drak^Har'koa^Tol'mar^Unfinished Business^Convocation at Zol'Heb^^Har'koa wants you to speak with Tol'mar at Dubra'jin.^While it is true that the Prophet of Akali will trouble this world no more
column2: there yet remains work to be done. The greater part of Akali's blood has empowered another
column3: and it is in him that the true danger lies. Quickly
column4: <name>
column5: make your way north of Gundrak to Dubra'Jin and speak with Tol'mar. He will be able to direct you further in this cause.

column1: For Posterity^78^All^Zul'Drak^Chronicler Bah'Kini^Chronicler Bah'Kini^Just Checkin'^^^Chronicler Bah'Kini at Dubra'Jin wants you to enter Gundrak and collect 6 Drakkari History Tablets.^Gundrak be doomed
column2: mon. History be repeatin' itself before our eyes. When trolls be turnin' on their own gods
column3: the end be certain. It just be a matter of time. Perhaps if we can record the events clearly
column4: we might prevent future generations from traveling down da same path. If you be havin' the courage
column5: enter Gundrak and search for clues to what brought the Drakkari Empire to such an end as dis.

column1: Just Checkin'^78^All^Zul'Drak^Chronicler To'kini^Chronicler Bah'Kini^Just Checkin'^^^To'kini wants you to speak to Bah'kini at Dubra'Jin.^There have been fearsome sounds echoing from Gundrak. They have been increasing in volume and frequency of late. My long-time student is currently recording events from her post just west of Gundrak. Perhaps you could find the time to check in on her for me?

Infused Mushroom Meatloaf^65^Alliance^Cooking^Katherine Lee^Orton Bennet^^^^Use your Meatloaf Pan to cook 4 Infused Mushrooms and 2 Chilled Meats and bring the finished Mushroom Meatloaf to Orton Bennet in Curiosities & Moore
column2: located in Runeweaver Square in Dalaran.^We have an important order that needs to go out! Orton Bennet in Curiosities & Moore needs a mushroom meatloaf. Get some infused mushrooms found in the Dalaran sewers
column3: chilled meat
column4: and cook them in this meatloaf pan. When you're done
column5: deliver the cooked meatloaf to Orton.

column1: Convention at the Legerdemain^65^Alliance^Cooking^Katherine Lee^Arille Azuregaze^^^^Bring 4 Northern Stew that you use your cooking skill to make and a Jug of Wine from the cheese shop in Dalaran to Arille Azuregaze at the Legerdemain Lounge found in Runeweaver Square in Dalaran.^Arille Azuregaze at the Legerdemain Lounge has a convention coming in and needs a feast pronto! You need to provide some Northern Stew and a Jug of Wine from the cheese shop "One More Glass" in central Dalaran. The owner of the cheese shop owes me the wine and you should find it somewhere around the shop. Bring the wine and stews to Arille.

Sewer Stew^65^Alliance^Cooking^Katherine Lee^Ajay Green^^^^Cook 4 Crystalsong Carrots from Crystalsong Forest with 4 Chilled Meat in the Cookpot.^Ajay Green the innkeeper in the Dalaran sewers needs a vegetable stew for his customers as they are running low on food down there. Collect 4 Crystalsong Carrots from the Crystalsong Forest and cook them together with 4 Chilled Meat. You can get to the Crystalsong Forest from the portal chamber in the eastern corner of Runeweaver Square. Once the vegetable stew is ready
column2: bring it to Ajay.

column1: Cheese for Glowergold^65^Alliance^Cooking^Katherine Lee^Ranid Glowergold^^^^Combine the empty cheese platter with Aged Dalaran Limburger from the cheese shop "One More Glass" and with 6 Half Full Dalaran Wine Glasses found on tables around Dalaran.^Ranid Glowergold in the Leatherworkers shop in Dalaran has had a sudden craving for wine and cheese. Collect cheese which is on the shelf at "One More Glass" in central Dalaran and half full wine glasses found on tables all over the city. Pour the wine together into a bottle and serve it with the cheese to Ranid. We don't think he will know the difference.
Once More Unto The Breach
column2: Hero^78^All^Icecrown^Highlord Tirion Fordring^The Ebon Watcher^^The Last Line Of Defense^^Report to the Ebon Watcher in the Valley of Echoes just outside the Breach.^The Vanguard is secure
column3: ally. We have reclaimed the Valley of Echoes and taken down the web walls blocking entry to the Breach. Now is the time to strike at Scourgeholme and establish our presence inside Icecrown. The battlefront moves on! I have asked the Ebon Watcher for his assistance with our assault upon Scourgeholme. His intimate knowledge of the Scourge will be invaluable in our effort. Go now and report to him at the tent outside of the Breach
column4: northwest of here.

column1: Once More Unto The Breach
column2: Hero^78^All^Death Knight^Highlord Tirion Fordring^The Ebon Watcher^^The Last Line Of Defense^^Report to the Ebon Watcher in the Valley of Echoes just outside the Breach.^The Vanguard is secure
column3: ally. We have reclaimed the Valley of Echoes and taken down the web walls blocking entry to the Breach. Now is the time to strike at Scourgeholme and establish our presence inside Icecrown. The battlefront moves on! I have asked the Ebon Watcher for his assistance with our assault upon Scourgeholme. His intimate knowledge of the Scourge will be invaluable in our effort. Go now and report to him at the tent outside of the Breach
column4: northwest of here.

column1: Blackwatch^80^All^Icecrown^Baron Sliver^Darkrider Arly^^^Where Are They Coming From?^Speak to Darkrider Arly at Blackwatch in Icecrown.^The Scourge has a large facility called the Fleshwerks
column2: dedicated to producing abominations and flesh giants. If we can shut it down
column3: we can deprive the Lich King of a large component of his armies. I've sent Darkrider Arly to the area. She has a small base
column4: Blackwatch
column5: on a ridge overlooking the Fleshwerks and to the west of Corp'rethar. I'm told the Argent Crusade is sending someone to coordinate their efforts there
column6: but the darkrider will know what to do. Find and assist her.

column1: Mustard Dogs!^65^Alliance^Cooking^Katherine Lee^Archmage Pentarus^^^^Fill the Empty Picnic Basket with 4 Rhino Dogs that you cook with your cooking skill and 4 Wild Mustard that you find in the grassy areas of Dalaran.^Archmage Pentarus likes to watch the occasional game of battle ball and is preparing to go
column2: but needs food for the trip. You need to fill his picnic basket with 4 rhino dogs that you cook and then 4 wild mustard that are found in grassy areas of the city. Bring him his picnic basket so he can be ready to go see the big game.

column1: Whatever it Takes!^80^All^Halls of Lightning^King Jokkum^King Jokkum^The Reckoning^^^King Jokkum in Dun Niffelem wants you to enter the Halls of Lightning and defeat Loken. You are then to return to King Jokkum with Loken's Tongue.^One way or another
column2: Loken shall fall. If I have to rip him limb from limb myself
column3: he soon shall pay for his wretched deeds. Should you meet with him before I do
column4: the honor and glory of his defeat shall be yours. Return to me with his lying tongue
column5: and earn my blessing and gratitude.

column1: Diametrically Opposed^80^All^Halls of Lightning^King Jokkum^King Jokkum^^The Reckoning^^King Jokkum at Dun Niffelem wants you to enter the Halls of Lightning and defeat Volkhan.^I shall speak plainly to you
column2: little <race>. My people have not been the same since our ties with Thorim were severed. As their leader
column3: I wish nothing more than for their hearts to be mended and our friendship with the Stormlord to be renewed. In your defeat of Fjorn
column4: a step has been taken down that path. I would have you bring us a step further... In the Halls of Lightning
column5: one even greater than Fjorn sits in opposition to our existence. Volkhan will not rest until either he
column6: or we
column7: are no more.

column1: The Restless Dead^78^All^Icecrown^Father Gustav^Father Gustav^^^Into The Frozen Heart Of Northrend^Father Gustav at the Valley of Echoes in Icecrown wants you to use Holy Water on the corpses of Reanimated Crusaders to free 10 restless souls.^Not all of our soldiers made it out of Scourgeholme. Many were slain and turned into twisted reflections of their former selves. Such is the way of the Scourge. For those damned souls
column2: there is no eternal peace. We must provide their souls rest. Travel through the Breach into Scourgeholme and slay the skeletal reanimated crusaders. Sprinkle this holy water on their bones so that their spirits may be freed.

column1: One of a Kind^78^All^Zul'Drak^Chronicler Bah'Kini^Chronicler Bah'Kini^^^^Chronicler Bah'Kini at Dubra'Jin wants you to enter Gundrak and recover a piece of the Drakkari Colossus.^Lissen
column2: mon. At first glance
column3: it be lookin' like da same old story here - trolls tappin' into forbidden powah by destroyin' da very beings dey should be worshippin'. While dis be true
column4: dere be somethin' special about dese Drakkari. If what I learned be true
column5: den inside Gundrak dere be a special golem - one like nuthin' created before! Ya want adventure
column6: mon? Go inside Gundrak and bring me back a piece from dat golem ta study.

column1: Infused Mushroom Meatloaf^65^Horde^Cooking^Awilo Lon'gomba^Orton Bennet^^^^Use your Meatloaf Pan to cook 4 Infused Mushrooms and 2 Chilled Meats and bring the finished Mushroom Meatloaf to Orton Bennet in Curiosities & Moore
column2: located in Runeweaver Square in Dalaran.^Orton Bennet in Curiosities & Moore be needin' a mushroom meatloaf. Get ya some infused mushrooms found in the Dalaran sewers
column3: chilled meat
column4: and cook 'em in the meatloaf pan. When ye be done
column5: bring that meatloaf to Orton. If only de council would let me serve me gnome specialty
column6: I would show dem a real treat!

column1: Convention at the Legerdemain^65^Horde^Cooking^Awilo Lon'gomba^Arille Azuregaze^^^^Bring 4 Northern Stews and a Jug of Wine from the cheese shop in Dalaran to Arille Azuregaze at the Legerdemain Lounge found in Runeweaver Square in Dalaran.^Can you believe da horde has outlawed cannibalism...it just ain't right I tell ya! I guess I should keep me mind on me work when we gots an order to fill. Arille Azuregaze at the Legerdemain Lounge has many a guest a'comin to his place
column2: mon. You gots to be providin' some Northern Stew and a Jug of Wine from the cheese shop in central Dalaran. Bring the wine and stew to Arille.

column1: Sewer Stew^65^Horde^Cooking^Awilo Lon'gomba^Ajay Green^^^^Cook 4 Crystalsong Carrots from Crystalsong Forest with 4 Chilled Meat in the Cookpot.^We be havin' another order to fill. Da innkeeper in da Dalaran sewers needs a vegetable stew as his customers dey don't have so much to eat
column2: mon. He asked for a vegetable stew as he didn't appreciate da gnome that was in the last stew I sent. Get 4 Crystalsong Carrots from the Crystalsong Forest and cook them together with 4 Chilled Meat and bring it to Ajay. You can be gettin' to da Forest from da portal chamber in da eastern corner of Runeweaver Square.

column1: Cheese for Glowergold^65^Horde^Cooking^Awilo Lon'gomba^Ranid Glowergold^^^^Combine the empty cheese platter with Aged Dalaran Limburger from the cheese shop "One More Glass" and with 6 Half Full Dalaran Wine Glasses found on tables around Dalaran.^Ranid Glowergold in da Leatherworkers shop be havin' a need for wine and cheese. Why he don't want some tasty gnome is beyond me. Collect da cheese from da cheese shop in central Dalaran and da half full wine glasses found on tables around da city. Bring da wine and serve it with the cheese to Ranid. You can call da wine a Wine Medley
column2: mon'.

column1: Mustard Dogs!^65^Horde^Cooking^Awilo Lon'gomba^Archmage Pentarus^^^^Fill the Empty Picnic Basket with 4 Rhino Dogs that you be cookin' with your skill and 4 Wild Mustard that you find in the grassy areas of Dalaran.^Da Archmage Pentarus likes to be watchin' his crazy battle ball game
column2: but he be needin' some food for da game. You be needin' to fill his picnic basket with 4 cooked rhino dogs and then 4 wild mustard that are found in da grassy corners of de city. Fill up his basket with the mustard dog goodies
column3: mon'.

column1: Where Are They Coming From?^80^All^Icecrown^Darkrider Arly^Darkrider Arly^^Blackwatch^Destroying the Altars
column2: Death's Gaze
column3: I'm Not Dead Yet!
column4: I'm Not Dead Yet!^Investigate a Summoning Altar in the eastern part of the Fleshwerks
column5: then report back to Darkrider Arly at Blackwatch.^The Lich King's tireless minions labor away night and day to assemble scores of abominations and flesh giants down there in the Fleshwerks. Yet
column6: that is not enough. More and more skeletal constructors keep appearing to increase the pace of work. If we do not discover where they're coming from and how they're able to work so quickly
column7: we'll be overrun before we can act in force. Search to the southeast and see if you can find the source of these skeletons.

column1: The Purging Of Scourgeholme^78^All^Icecrown^The Ebon Watcher^The Ebon Watcher^^^The Air Stands Still^The Ebon Watcher at the Valley of Echoes in Icecrown wants you to kill 3 Forgotten Depths High Priests
column2: 3 Forgotten Depths Underkings
column3: and 8 Reanimated Crusaders.^The Scourge have sent their armies at the Argent Crusade and have been repelled. What they do now is called a 'slash and burn.' All prisoners that they hold at Scourgeholme will be executed and raised as servants of the Lich King. Undoubtedly the Argent Crusade will request that you give their soldiers a proper farewell. I'll ask no such thing of you. To succeed we must kill Scourge indiscriminately. Venture to Scourgeholme
column4: northwest through the Breach
column5: and lay waste to all that stand in your way.

column1: Destroying the Altars^80^All^Icecrown^Darkrider Arly^Darkrider Arly^^Where Are They Coming From?^Spill Their Blood^Kill Master Summoner Zarod and use his Summoning Stave to destroy the First
column2: Second
column3: Third
column4: and Fourth Summoning Altars. When you've completed this task
column5: report to Darkrider Arly at Blackwatch.^So they're summoning in their workers and warriors at those altars? They'll need to be the first thing to go. The master summoner should have a staff which allows him to activate the portal. If you kill the master summoner and take the staff
column6: you can use it to overload the summoning portal and destroy its altar. Do this at all four of the altars and return to me once they've been destroyed.

column1: Death's Gaze^80^All^Icecrown^Darkrider Arly^Darkrider Arly^^Where Are They Coming From?^Spill Their Blood^Use the Death's Gaze Orb to place orbs on the Abomination Lab Orb Stand
column2: the Flesh Giant Lab Orb Stand
column3: and the Cauldron Area Orb Stand
column4: then return to Darkrider Arly at Blackwatch.^The Fleshwerks is a vast operation
column5: and it will be difficult to keep an eye on all that transpires there. Fortunately
column6: I have a plan. <Arly produces an orb from the folds of her cloak and shows it to you.> This is a death's gaze orb. With it
column7: we can observe the Scourge's actions and decide how best to strike. Place these orbs on the stands at three crucial areas -- the abomination lab and the flesh giant lab to the southwest
column8: along with the area surrounding the green cauldron far to the west.

column1: Through the Eye^80^All^Icecrown^The Bone Witch^The Bone Witch^The Sum is Greater than the Parts^^^The Bone Witch in Njorndar Village has tasked you with using the Eye of the Lich King to gain information.^We must use the Lich King's tools against him if we are to decide our next step. Over the mountain to the southwest lies Kul'galar Keep. Within it reside the oracles of Jotunheim who receive orders from their master and scry upon others through the Eye of the Lich King. It is the eye that you must fight your way to. While it cannot be used to pierce the veil within Icecrown Citadel
column2: you should be able to use it to discern something of value so that we will know how best to proceed.

column1: The Scourgestone^78^All^Icecrown^The Ebon Watcher^The Ebon Watcher^^^The Air Stands Still^The Ebon Watcher at the Valley of Echoes in Icecrown wants you to bring him 15 Scourgestones.^A Scourgestone is an item given to all Scourge upon birth or creation. It provides certain benefits to the holder
column2: but more importantly it allows Scourge leaders visibility into the location and movement of all of their units. With enough Scourgestones
column3: I might be able to track the movement of other Scourge units across Icecrown. As you slaughter Scourge in Scourgeholme
column4: gather all of the Scourgestones that you find. Return to me when your bags are full.

column1: The Struggle Persists^80^All^The Oculus^Raelorasz^Belgaristrasz^The Struggle Persists^^^Raelorasz wants you to enter the Oculus and rescue Belgaristrasz and his companions.^The battle goes on
column2: <name>. Somehow we have managed to avoid detection and continue our attempts to frustrate Malygos' schemes. This
column3: though
column4: is where the good news ends and the bad begins. Our best efforts have had little or no effect. Malygos and his underlings grow stronger in power with each passing day. And now
column5: our latest assault team has been captured and is being held in the Oculus. We must attempt a rescue! Belgaristrasz and his companions are invaluable to our cause. Can we count on you
column6: <name>?

column1: The Air Stands Still^79^All^Icecrown^The Ebon Watcher^The Ebon Watcher^^The Purging Of Scourgeholme
column2: The Scourgestone^Into The Frozen Heart Of Northrend^The Ebon Watcher at the Valley of Echoes in Icecrown wants you to kill Salranax the Flesh Render
column3: Underking Talonox and High Priest Yath'amon.^You must defeat the lords of Scourgeholme if this place is to be free of the Scourge's grasp. Salranax the Flesh Render lords over the temple on the first tier of Scourgeholme. Nearby Salranax you'll find High Priest Yath'amon preaching at the spirit tower on the second tier. Underking Talonox holds court at the Pit of Fiends
column4: up the high road. These are formidable opponents and must be approached with caution. Use this war horn should you require aid. The death knights of Acherus will come.

column1: A Unified Front^80^All^The Oculus^Belgaristrasz^Image of Belgaristrasz^The Struggle Persists^^^Belgaristrasz wants you to destroy 10 Centrifuge Constructs to bring down Varos' shield. You then must defeat Varos Cloudstrider.^Please accept our gratitude
column2: <race>. You and your friends have succeeded where we had failed - you have bested Drakos. From here
column3: however
column4: it will take our combined efforts to proceed. Above us
column5: Varos hides behind an impenetrable shield. To reach him
column6: you must defeat the Centrifuge Constructs that power his shield. That is where my friends and I come in.... We each can provide you with drakes from our respective flights. Only with the help of these drakes will you be able to expose Varos.

column1: Mage-Lord Urom^80^All^The Oculus^Image of Belgaristrasz^Image of Belgaristrasz^The Struggle Persists^^^Belgaristrasz wants you to defeat Mage-Lord Urom in the Oculus.^Only one obstacle stands between us and our ultimate goal here
column2: <class>. His name is Urom. Above us
column3: guarding the third ring
column4: he awaits us. Beware his powerful conjurings
column5: friend. He is a frightful opponent
column6: certain to challenge your prowess. Bring him down. Make him pay for his treacherous allegiance to the enemy!

column1: A Wing and a Prayer^80^All^The Oculus^Image of Belgaristrasz^Raelorasz^The Struggle Persists^^^Belgaristrasz wants you to kill Eregos in the Oculus and then report to Raelorasz at the Transitus Shield in Coldarra.^The time has come to face Eregos
column2: friend. He is cunning and strong. One of Malygos' most trusted minions
column3: he draws strength from the energies he is charged with defending - sipping from the well of the great aspect himself. This shall not be easy.... However
column4: defeating the Mage-Lord has allowed us to unlock the full power of our drakes. Their skills shall be at your command. Use them wisely and Eregos shall surely fall. Should you succeed
column5: return to Raelorasz and inform him of our victory.

column1: Head Games^74^All^Drak'Tharon Keep^Kurzel^Mack Fearsen^Seared Scourge^^^Kurzel wants you to use Kurzel's Blouse Scrap at the corpse of Novos the Summoner
column2: then take the Ichor-Stained Cloth to Mack.^Too lazy for their own good.... Wait! I know how to teach 'em! <Kurzel rips a long strip of material from her blouse and hands it to you.> Here
column3: <race>
column4: take this. Dip it in the remains of that annoying lich over there and return it to Mack back at the camp. Once the boys have stewed in their guilt for a while I'll show up and let them off the hook. They'll learn not to let a lady wander off alone!

column1: The Stone That Started A Revolution^79^All^Icecrown^Crusade Architect Silas^Crusade Architect Silas^^^Into The Frozen Heart Of Northrend^Crusade Architect Silas at the Valley of Echoes in Icecrown wants you to retrieve 10 Trunks of Crystalline Heartwood and 10 pieces of Ancient Elven Masonry.^You may look at Scourgeholme now and see a rancid pit of decay
column2: but one day it will be a place of glory and honor. Highlord Fordring has deemed it "Justice Keep." Alas
column3: even an impregnable fortress like Icecrown Citadel began with but a single stone. So begins our search for the stone to start a revolution. Travel to Crystalsong
column4: south of here
column5: and seek out the Unbound Thicket in the east. Once there gather crystalline heartwood from the thicket floor and elven masonry from the Ruins of Shandaral.

column1: Junk in My Trunk^80^All^Utgarde Pinnacle^Brigg Smallshanks^Brigg Smallshanks^^^^Brigg in Utgarde Pinnacle wants you to find 5 Untarnished Silver Bars
column2: 3 Shiny Baubles
column3: 2 Golden Goblets
column4: and a Jade Statue.^Just look at it! Me trunk never been so empty. Shoulda been filled ten times over by now! Me mates jumped at the sight o' all that booty
column5: and now look at 'em! Rattlin' bones
column6: they be! It be like me mammy use 'ta tell me - only thing worse than no treasure be cursed treasure. Say
column7: thar be plenty o' loot farther in
column8: an' not the cursed kind I'll wager. These sots not be needin' it - it just be junk ta them. Fetch it fer me an' I'll be rewardin' ya handsomely
column9: matey.

column1: Vengeance Be Mine!^80^All^Utgarde Pinnacle^Brigg Smallshanks^Brigg Smallshanks^^^^Brigg in Utgarde Pinnacle wants you to kill King Ymiron.^Och! They cannae be blamed
column2: <lad/lass>. Who'da done different? They hurled themselves at them piles o' gold - thought they'd hit the mother lode
column3: they did. Aye... But look at 'em now. Mindless servants unable to pick up a single doubloon. Only luck spared me from the same fate. In the scurry I got knocked down - was a wee bit tipsy to begin with. Looked up ta see the first of 'em turn... Be a good <lad/lass> and find the one in charge here and teach 'em not ta be cursin' me mates.

column1: Find the Ancient Hero^80^All^Icecrown^The Bone Witch^The Bone Witch^The Sum is Greater than the Parts^^^The Bone Witch at Njorndar Village wants you to return with Iskalder.^Quickly
column2: <name>
column3: head southwest to the Halls of the Ancestors! Within you will find slumbering mjordin. Wake them until you find Iskalder. When you do
column4: use this amulet upon him and bring him back to me. Now go. There is no time to waste!

column1: Spill Their Blood^80^All^Icecrown^Darkrider Arly^Darkrider Arly^^Destroying the Altars
column2: Death's Gaze^Jagged Shards^Darkrider Arly at Blackwatch wants you to destroy 5 vats of Embalming Fluid and 5 Blood Orbs.^The Scourge cannot create their flesh monsters without blood and embalming fluid to preserve the parts and keep them functioning. If we can deny them these materials
column3: their army will fall apart and we can easily destroy their creations. Throughout the labs where the flesh giants and abominations are cobbled together
column4: you will find vats of embalming fluid and large orbs filled with blood. Destroy these
column5: and bring death to any who would stop you!

column1: It Could Kill Us All^79^All^Icecrown^Crusade Engineer Spitzpatrick^Crusade Engineer Spitzpatrick^^^Into The Frozen Heart Of Northrend^Crusade Engineer Spitzpatrick at the Valley of Echoes in Icecrown wants you to retrieve 8 pieces of Crystallized Energy.^Southeast of here
column2: at the eastern reaches of Crystalsong Forest
column3: is an area known as the Unbound Thicket. Within that thicket creeps all manner of life. One thing all of the affected creatures of the thicket share in common is their affinity for magical energy. Each of them holds pure
column4: crystallized energy. Enough to kill us all should it ever destabilize! Travel to the Unbound Thicket and kill its denizens for crystallized energy. We need fuel and they need to die. We call that a "win-win."

column1: Jagged Shards^80^All^Icecrown^Jagged Shard^Crusader Olakin Sainrith^^Spill Their Blood^^Bring 10 Jagged Shards to Crusader Olakin Sainrith at Blackwatch.^You pulled this jagged
column2: dark brittle shard from the body of a ghoul. The metal blade lacks a smooth edge
column3: suggesting it was forged by an unskilled hand
column4: or was broken from a larger piece. You recall seeing similar shards embedded in the bodies of all the ghouls you've encountered at the Fleshwerks
column5: leading you to wonder why their creators bothered to include the metal at all. Perhaps Crusader Olakin Sainrith would have some insight if you brought him the shards from several ghouls.

column1: Not-So-Honorable Combat^80^All^Icecrown^The Bone Witch^The Bone Witch^The Sum is Greater than the Parts^^^The Bone Witch in Njorndar Village wants you to defeat Iskalder upon Battlescar Spire.^Atop the tallest peak to the southwest overlooking Jotunheim is Battlescar Spire. It is a place of reverence for the vrykul
column2: second only to Valhalas in terms of where they prefer to do honorable combat. We shall visit not-so-honorable combat upon it. Gather your companions and fly to the spire. When you are ready
column3: light the signal fire and I will appear within the body of Iskalder. We will fight
column4: you will win
column5: and Vardmadra is sure to come to witness the battle!

column1: I'm Smelting... Smelting!^80^All^Icecrown^Crusader Olakin Sainrith^Crusader Olakin Sainrith^^^^Use the Bag of Jagged Shards near one of the bottom level Malykriss furnaces. Return to Crusader Olakin Sainrith at Blackwatch with the Smelted Metal Bar.^<Olakin turns one of the shards over in an armored fist.> These could pierce armor with enough force. We have to find out what they're made of and what the Lich King intends to do with them. To the east
column2: nestled next to Icecrown Citadel itself
column3: lies Malykriss. From the few reports we have
column4: it's full of smelting and smithing equipment. Bring these shards there
column5: and smelt them in one of the open furnaces on the bottom level of Malykriss. Once the metal has been reformed
column6: we can identify it.

column1: Into The Frozen Heart Of Northrend^79^All^Icecrown^Father Gustav^Highlord Tirion Fordring^Into The Frozen Heart Of Northrend^The Restless Dead
column2: The Air Stands Still
column3: The Stone That Started A Revolution
column4: It Could Kill Us All^The Battle For Crusaders' Pinnacle^Deliver Father Gustav's Report to Highlord Tirion Fordring at the Argent Vanguard in Icecrown.^Silas and Spitzpatrick have signed off on the materials and fuel needed to begin construction of Justice Keep. Thanks to you and the Ebon Blade the Scourge presence within Scourgeholme has been decimated and their lieutenants have been defeated. I have chosen the site at which we will break ground
column5: but first you must deliver my report to Highlord Tirion Fordring. We will begin our march into Icecrown on his command.

column1: The Runesmiths of Malykriss^80^All^Icecrown^Crusader Olakin Sainrith^Crusader Olakin Sainrith^^^^Bring 5 Runed Saronite Plates to Crusader Olakin Sainrith at Blackwatch.^Those shards you recovered can only have come from one place
column2: Malykriss. It's the seat of the Lich King's metalworking operations
column3: to the east of Corp'rethar. What's puzzling is that metal isn't needed to stitch together abominations or flesh giants
column4: or to summon skeletal servants. Find the skeletal runesmiths working on the bottom level of Malykriss and capture the plates they're working on. We need to find out why this metal is finding its way to the Fleshwerks.

column1: The Battle For Crusaders' Pinnacle^79^All^Icecrown^Highlord Tirion Fordring^Father Gustav^Into The Frozen Heart Of Northrend^^The Crusaders' Pinnacle^Venture to Crusaders' Pinnacle and use the Blessed Banner of the Crusade atop the Pile of Crusader Skulls. Defend the banner against Scourge attack until the land atop the pinnacle is sanctified and then return to Father Gustav at the Valley of Echoes in Icecrown.^<Highlord Fordring holds a banner of the Argent Crusade.> This banner is like no other
column2: <name>. It carries with it a powerful blessing
column3: able to sanctify large tracts of blighted land. You must take it northwest
column4: through the Breach
column5: to an area the Scourge have mockingly named Crusaders' Pinnacle. Plant the banner atop the skulls of our fallen brethren at Crusaders' Pinnacle and defend it against attack. Once the land is sanctified
column6: return to Father Gustav. Go now
column7: <name>. Hold no fear in your heart.
