column1: Banshee's Revenge^80^All^Icecrown^The Bone Witch^The Bone Witch^The Sum is Greater than the Parts^^^The Bone Witch at Njorndar Village has asked you to exact her revenge by challenging and defeating Overthane Balargarde.^The time has come
column2: <name>. You and your friends must challenge the lord of Balargarde Fortress
column3: the master of Jotunheim
column4: Overthane Balargarde. Atop the fortress
column5: which is on the southwestern edge of Jotunheim
column6: you will find a horn. Blow into it. Allow your challenge to resound throughout the steadfast. Balargarde will have no choice but to face you. And I... excuse me
column7: Vardmadra will be there to adjudicate the challenge. <The banshee-possessed vrykul lets out a bellowing cackle.>

column1: New Recruit^80^All^Icecrown^Vereth the Cunning^Vereth the Cunning^Vereth the Cunning^^^Vereth the Cunning on the Rise of Suffering has requested that you bring a subdued Lithe Stalker to the top of the rocks northeast of the Rise of Suffering.^First things first. I saw some Lithe Stalkers on the ramparts just east of us. They used to serve us before we broke with Arthas
column2: and they're about as perfect a scout as you can get... with a little prodding from an eye of dominion. Fly up
column3: find one of the stalkers
column4: beat it down a bit
column5: and then use this Sigil of the Ebon Blade to command its obedience. It will recognize the sigil
column6: guaranteed. Lead it back to the top of the rocks northeast of here and it will find its way to me.

column1: Killing Two Scourge With One Skeleton^80^All^Icecrown^Darkrider Arly^Darkrider Arly^^A Visit to the Doctor
column2: By Fire Be Purged^He's Gone to Pieces
column3: Let's Get Out of Here!
column4: Let's Get Out of Here^Darkrider Arly at Blackwatch wants you to destroy 3 Chained Abominations with Burning Skeletons.^The workers in the Fleshwerks abomination lab have already completed a number of their creations. For now
column5: the creatures are chained to the pillars around the edge of the lab
column6: but if we do not act
column7: they will march with the Lich King's armies. Grasping arms reach out of the bone piles spread throughout the Fleshwerks. These arms belong to skeletons enchanted with the power of fire. Find and free these skeletons
column8: then take them near the completed abominations and watch the show!

column1: The Vile Hold^80^All^Icecrown^Vereth the Cunning^Vereth the Cunning^Vereth the Cunning^^Generosity Abounds
column2: Matchmaker
column3: Stunning View^Vereth the Cunning at the Rise of Suffering has requested that you use a Lithe Stalker to scout out Malykriss.^We need to know what we're up against. Use the eye of dominion to assume control of a lithe stalker and scout out the area. There are a few spots in particular I saw when flying in that I want you to get a closer look at: the overlook in the northeast
column4: the work area in the southeast
column5: the large forge near the center
column6: and the ritual area in the southwest. The stalker can leap far and won't be hurt by large falls - use that to your advantage to get up and down from those ramparts.

column1: Generosity Abounds^80^All^Icecrown^Vereth the Cunning^Vereth the Cunning^^The Vile Hold^^Vereth the Cunning wants you to use the Lithe Stalker's Iron Chain to drag Scourge Bombs to 4 Lumbering Atrocities inside Malykriss.^We need to cause some disruption... anything to bring those death knights away from their leaders. If we lay waste to their minions below
column2: I suspect they'll have to devote more attention to keeping a close eye on operations. Abominations are easy prey - slow
column3: predictable
column4: and most importantly
column5: stupid. Take advantage of their trust of the stalkers to drag them some of the Scourge bombs scattered throughout the construction area. You'll be able light the bombs far before they figure out what's going on.

column1: Matchmaker^80^All^Icecrown^Vereth the Cunning^Vereth the Cunning^^The Vile Hold^^Vereth the Cunning at the Rise of Suffering wants you to use a Lithe Stalker to throw rocks at Umbral Brutes as they near lesser undead in Malykriss. Return after you've started 5 fights.^The major difference between vargul and lesser undead minions is that vargul still possess enough of their minds to despise being used for labor. Never will a vargul be pleased to be working aside skeletons or ghouls. Lets take advantage of this inevitable animosity and start some fights between the umbral brutes and the other undead in Malykriss. That should serve to slow production and bring the death knights down to babysit. Should be simple - throw rocks at the brutes as they near lesser undead.

Necklace Repair^77^All^Jewelcrafting^Damaged Necklace^Timothy Jones^^^^Repair the necklace with a single Chalcedony and return it to Timothy Jones in at the Jewelcrafters Shop in the Magus Commerce Exchange in Dalaran.^This damaged necklace has an invoice with it that reads "Property of Timothy Jones - Cartier and Co Fine Jewelry - Magus Commerce Exhange - Dalaran". Perhaps you should repair it and return it to him.
Dispelling Illusions^80^All^The Culling of Stratholme^Chromie^Chromie^Dispelling Illusions^^^Chromie wants you to use the Arcane Disruptor on the suspicious crates in Stratholme Past
column2: then speak to her near the entrance to Stratholme.^Always meddling... The Infinite Dragonflight seek to disrupt history as we have come to know it by deceiving Prince Arthas. If they can convince him that none of the grain here carries the plague
column3: then he'll never have to make the fateful decision to cull Stratholme. This must not come to pass. Use this Arcane Disruptor on any suspicious crates of grain you find to reveal them for what they are. Meet me near Stratholme's entrance
column4: north of this place
column5: when the work is done.

column1: A Royal Escort^80^All^The Culling of Stratholme^Chromie^Chromie^Dispelling Illusions^^^Chromie has asked you to accompany Arthas in the Culling of Stratholme. You are to speak with her again after Mal'Ganis is defeated.^The Infinite Dragonflight are not likely to give up so easily. I cannot be certain of what they're up to
column2: but something tells me we haven't seen the last of them today. In just a moment
column3: Arthas will face a desperate dilemma
column4: and make a momentous decision. Don't lose focus now
column5: <name>. I needn't remind you how much is at stake. I must call upon you to accompany the prince in his culling of Stratholme. Arthas must make it through Stratholme alive and you must see to it that he defeats Mal'Ganis!

column1: A Visit to the Doctor^80^All^Icecrown^Darkrider Arly^Darkrider Arly^^^Killing Two Scourge With One Skeleton^Darkrider Arly at Blackwatch wants you to destroy the Metal Stake imprisoning Patches in the Sanctum of Reanimation and help him get his revenge on Doctor Sabnok.^So they've been embedding these ghouls with broken shards of saronite down in the Sanctum of Reanimation? We must put a stop to this
column2: before these ghouls can be deployed against our troops. Find the entrance to the Sanctum of Reanimation in the flesh giant lab area of the Fleshwerks. There
column3: the ghoul mastermind
column4: Doctor Sabnok
column5: keeps the most fearsome of his creations
column6: Patches. Free Patches from his chains and help him take his revenge on the doctor. Let his own creation be his undoing.

column1: Warding the Warriors^80^Alliance^Wintergrasp^Sorceress Kaylana^Sorceress Kaylana^^^^Sorceress Kaylana at Wintergrasp Fortress wants you to retrieve 10 sets of Imbued Horde Armor from Horde players at the Glacial Falls.^<name>
column2: good to see you. While the battle has subsided for now
column3: we must hurry and replenish our stocks. My research indicates that the armor of soldiers recently slain in the Glacial Falls becomes imbued with an incredible amount of energy. The Horde has been seen collecting armor in the area. Head to the Glacial Falls and slay any of the Horde you find there. Return their imbued armor to me. If you cannot find any of the Horde
column4: you might find the armor of an adventurer slain by the elementals.

column1: Bones and Arrows^80^Alliance^Wintergrasp^Bowyer Randolph^Bowyer Randolph^^^^Bowyer Randolph at Wintergrasp Fortress wants you to retrieve 10 Quivers of Dragonbone Arrows from Horde players at the Forest of Shadows.^Dragons are incredible! Well
column2: their bones at least! I've been equipping our archers with arrowheads made of Dragonbone. Unfortunately
column3: since the massacre at Angrathar
column4: it has become almost impossible to get bone from Dragonblight. However
column5: the Forest of Shadows on the western edge of Wintergrasp has enough bones to tide us over. Head to the Forest of Shadows and bring back any bone splinters you can find! The Horde have been seen collecting bone splinters in the area. Slay them!

column1: Vereth the Cunning^80^All^Icecrown^Keritose Bloodblade^Vereth the Cunning^Vereth the Cunning^Seeds of Chaos
column2: Amidst the Confusion^^Report to Vereth the Cunning on the Rise of Suffering in Icecrown.^I've already heard some rumors regarding Malykriss and Arthas's new death knight order
column3: but I assumed it nothing more than filling the void. These numbers suggest he's trying to take it up a notch though. We dispatched one of our best to Malykriss not long ago - Vereth the Cunning. You should be able to find him on the Rise of Suffering
column4: just west of Malykriss
column5: and inside the Court of Bones. Try not to draw too much attention on your way in.

column1: A Rare Herb^80^Alliance^Wintergrasp^Anchorite Tessa^Anchorite Tessa^^^^Anchorite Tessa in Wintergrasp Fortress wants you to retrieve 10 Horde Herb Pouches from Horde players in the Steppe of Life.^My
column2: it its quite chilly up here! Reminds me of the stormy peaks of Kaarinos on Argus. However
column3: with all of this snow and ice
column4: our soldiers can easily catch cold. Head to the Steppe of Life in southwestern Wintergrasp
column5: and bring me back 10 of the Horde herb pouches you find. I will grind them into a medicine to help protect against the cold. The Horde have been seen collecting them from the plant life in the area. Do not hesitate to slay them and retrieve the herbs!

column1: The Crusaders' Pinnacle^79^All^Icecrown^Father Gustav^Highlord Tirion Fordring^Into The Frozen Heart Of Northrend^^^Seek out Highlord Tirion Fordring at Crusaders' Pinnacle in Icecrown.^Stand proud in knowing that it was you who helped establish the Argent Crusade inside the walls of Icecrown
column2: <name>. The Crusaders' Pinnacle now stands in direct defiance of the Lich King and his twisted minions. Highlord Fordring and the crusaders who survived await your arrival at Crusaders' Pinnacle. Travel once more through the Breach and seek out the highlord!

column1: Discretion is Key^77^All^The Violet Hold^Rhonin^Warden Alturas^Discretion is Key^^^Rhonin wants you to go to the Violet Hold in Dalaran and speak with Warden Alturas.^Listen to me
column2: <race>. It's just been brought to my attention that there's been an incident at the Violet Hold. It would appear that the blues are launching a full scale invasion of Dalaran! I need you to get to the prison and speak with Warden Alturas at once. He'll give you the details. That is not all. I need this handled with utmost discretion. We mustn't alarm the citizens of Dalaran if it can possibly be avoided. Do I make myself clear? Very well. Now
column3: go!

column1: Containment^77^All^The Violet Hold^Warden Alturas^Warden Alturas^Discretion is Key^^^Warden Alturas wants you to enter the Violet Hold and put and end to the blue dragon invasion force. You are to report back to him once Cyanigosa is slain.^Here is the prison key. My men and I will stay here as a last line of defense in the event that you are unable to overcome the assault. Be sure to speak with Lieutenant Sinclari. She'll provide you with access to the prison's defenses. Hurry
column2: <race>. There is little time. The few I left inside won't last long without your help. Report back to me once the invasion forces have been successfully dealt with.

column1: Stunning View^80^All^Icecrown^Vereth the Cunning^Vereth the Cunning^^The Vile Hold^^Vereth the Cunning at the Rise of Suffering wants you to use a Lithe Stalker's heave ability to destroy 12 sleeping Iceskin Sentries.^Gargoyles make effective scouts and can be deadly if left to rain attacks from the air
column2: but they have a very obvious weakness. Most of them have to go through long periods resting as stone to maintain the energy they need to carry their heavy bodies through the air. As I peered through the eye you were using
column3: I noticed dozens of iceskin sentries resting on the eastern and southern walls inside. Use the stalker to leap up to their ledges and devastate them while they sleep.

column1: The Rider of the Unholy^80^All^Icecrown^Vereth the Cunning^Vereth the Cunning^^^The Fate of Bloodbane^Vereth the Cunning on the Rise of Suffering wants you to kill Rokir
column2: the Rider of the Unholy.^It's time that we start cutting off the heads of the beast. I served beside Rokir for quite some time. He knows the unholy arts better than most any other death knight I've met and he's equally as ruthless. Rokir's strengths are most apparent when you are fighting him on his own ground. Sadly
column3: we don't have much option in those regards
column4: but stay on your feet to avoid his undead minions and you should come out victorious. Be nimble
column5: <class>
column6: and do not take him lightly.

column1: The Rider of Frost^80^All^Icecrown^Vereth the Cunning^Vereth the Cunning^^^The Fate of Bloodbane^Vereth the Cunning on the Rise of Suffering wants you to kill Sapph
column2: the Rider of Frost.^Sapph... Sapph's a death knight like no other. She'll shower you with sweet words and you'll swear that she has no evil within her heart
column3: and then she'll run you through without even breaking her smile. I have no fear that you'll be able to best Sapph
column4: but do not grow overconfident. Her strength lies in lulling her victims into a false ease
column5: shortly before shattering them with a fierce barrage of frost attacks. Do not let your guard down
column6: and do not underestimate her.

column1: The Rider of Blood^80^All^Icecrown^Vereth the Cunning^Vereth the Cunning^^^The Fate of Bloodbane^Vereth the Cunning on the Rise of Suffering wants you to kill Baelok
column2: the Rider of Blood.^Baelok is one of the few vrykul that I've ever seen rise through the ranks
column3: and that was mostly accomplished through sheer brutality. If your competition ends up dead
column4: there's far less to compete against. When you join battle with him
column5: spread out from your companions and keep your distance as much as you reasonably can. He will not hesitate to steal your life force for himself
column6: so you will need to hinder his ability to do so as much as possible. You have my confidence. See to it that he dies.

column1: The Fate of Bloodbane^80^All^Icecrown^Vereth the Cunning^Vereth the Cunning^^The Rider of the Unholy
column2: The Rider of Frost
column3: The Rider of Blood^^Vereth on the Rise of Suffering has dispatched you to kill Orbaz Bloodbane.^With the riders of the Host of Suffering dead
column4: now is the time to put an end to their true leader: Orbaz Bloodbane. Mograine caught up with me while you were off and told me that he found where Orbaz is hiding. Under Icecrown Citadel itself
column5: there is an immense pit - you will find Orbaz just outside its lip. Some of the Ebon Blade's strongest agents have already been dispatched - gather aid and join the fight. It is time for Bloodbane to die.

column1: Taking Back Acherus^55^All^Death Knight^Highlord Darion Mograine^Highlord Darion Mograine^The Light of Dawn^^^Use your Death Gate spell to return to Acherus: The Ebon Hold. Report to Highlord Darion Mograine once you arrive.^The haze has been lifted. I can see as clearly now as the day that I plunged the Ashbringer into my own heart to free my father's cursed soul: my last memory as a free man. We must take back Acherus from the Scourge if our order is to survive in this new world. I have taught you how to call forth a death gate. The death gate will return you to Acherus when you call upon it
column2: <name>. Use it now and meet me at Acherus. The first battle of the Knights of the Ebon Blade is underway! Death to the Scourge!

column1: The Battle For The Ebon Hold^55^All^Death Knight^Highlord Darion Mograine^Highlord Darion Mograine^The Light of Dawn^^Where Kings Walk
column2: Warchief's Blessing^Slay 10 Scourge and help kill Patchwerk. Return to Highlord Darion Mograine should you succeed.^The Hall of Command has been secured
column3: but the Lich King has left us a little present in the Heart of Acherus. The stitched terror
column4: Patchwerk
column5: and a horde of abominations have taken over the second floor. Use the teleporter to get to the second floor and destroy the Scourge forces that remain. Do not engage Patchwerk alone! You must fight the monstrosity with other death knights of Acherus! Go
column6: <name>. You have my strength to carry you!

column1: Death to the Traitor King^74^All^Dragonblight^Kilix the Unraveler^Kilix the Unraveler^^^^Kilix the Unraveler in the Pit of Narjun has tasked you with defeating Anub'arak in Azjol-Nerub. You are to return to Kilix with Anub'arak's Broken Husk.^Anub'arak
column2: the traitor king
column3: makes his home in the once proud underland of Azjol-Nerub. Since his betrayal
column4: he has twisted and perverted our homeland into the wretched squalor it is today. He rules over an army of undead nerubians who
column5: like their leader
column6: have pledged themselves to serving the Lich King. Bring an end to the traitor king's reign
column7: <class>. You will be doing a great service to both of our peoples. If you manage to succeed where all others have failed
column8: bring me the husk of Anub'arak.

column1: Parting Gifts^80^All^Icecrown^Keritose Bloodblade^Keritose Bloodblade^^^^Keritose Bloodblade at the Shadow Vault wants you to use an Eye of Dominion to take control of a captured Eidolon Watcher.^Look what we have here... eyes of dominion. The Cult normally goes to great lengths to keep these things safe
column2: but I suppose their options for retreat are few when we're slaughtering them in their own home. The eyes allow a being of any relative power to control an undead minion's actions precisely. As you can imagine
column3: this can be extremely useful when it comes to your typical clumsy ghoul or skeleton. Care to try your hand at it? Use one of the eyes to control a captured shade.

column1: An Undead's Best Friend^80^All^Icecrown^Keritose Bloodblade^Keritose Bloodblade^^^^Keritose Bloodblade at the Shadow Vault wants you to use the Eidolon Watcher to feed 18 Hungering Plaguehounds.^As is usual practice
column2: the undead at the saronite quarry to the southwest starve plaguehounds to keep them extra aggressive. Use the shade to get up close and feed some of those hounds and I promise you they'll be content to leave you alone
column3: if not side with the hand that fed them. Don't get too close to those things until you've fed them though. Their noses don't fall victim to your shade's elusiveness.

column1: Honor is for the Weak^80^All^Icecrown^Keritose Bloodblade^Keritose Bloodblade^^^^Keritose Bloodblade at the Shadow Vault would like you to assassinate 20 Restless Lookouts.^Ghouls are fragile things when it comes down to it
column2: and the lookouts at the saronite quarry down the path to the southwest are no exception. Using one of the shades
column3: I have no doubt that you can sneak up and put down their lookouts without making a sound. Clear out as many lookouts as you can reach in a reasonable amount of time... we'll want their ranks thinned for our assault to come.

column1: From Whence They Came^80^All^Icecrown^Keritose Bloodblade^Keritose Bloodblade^^^^Keritose Bloodblade at the Shadow Vault has sent you to banish 10 Scourge Containment Crystals.^My main concern is the saronite quarry down the path to the southwest. They are pulling up immense amounts of ore from that quarry and I'd like to know what they're building with it. To that end
column2: we'll start by weakening their defenses. I noticed a series of crystals scattered throughout the base and I assume they are defensive structures of some sort
column3: not unlike ziggurats. Use the eidolon watcher to destroy any of those crystals that you find.

column1: Seeds of Chaos^80^All^Icecrown^Keritose Bloodblade^Keritose Bloodblade^^^Vereth the Cunning^Keritose Bloodblade at the Shadow Vault has dispatched you to slaughter 80 undead in the Weeping Quarry. Speak to him to secure a skeletal gryphon for the assault.^Effective tool
column2: is it not? Excellent job weakening their defenses
column3: <class>. Now we can push the main assault. The plan here is straight-foward - we're looking to destroy anything moving
column4: and get in there and steal some information amidst the confusion. Let me know when you're ready and I'll set you up with a skeletal gryphon.

column1: Amidst the Confusion^80^All^Icecrown^Keritose Bloodblade^Keritose Bloodblade^^^Vereth the Cunning^Keritose Bloodblade at the Shadow Vault has requested a Weeping Quarry Document
column2: a Weeping Quarry Ledger
column3: a Weeping Quarry Map
column4: and a Weeping Quarry Schedule.^Shutting down their operation is just half of the plan. The other important goal here is to find out where all that saronite is being sent. We know of a few places it's been ending up
column5: but the amount they're pulling out suggests to me that there's a bigger project in the works. Once you're inside the quarry
column6: get your hands on any of their documents that you can find. If you're assaulting the place with one of the gryphons
column7: you can drop down from it as soon as the wetwork is done.

column1: No Mercy for the Merciless^80^Alliance^Wintergrasp^Commander Zanneth^Commander Zanneth^^^^Commander Zanneth in Wintergrasp Fortress wants you to slay 10 members of the Horde.^Welcome to the Wintergrasp Fortress
column2: <name>. Your mission is simple. Defeat ten of the Horde's finest. Now
column3: go! Bring victory to the Alliance!

column1: Slay them all!^80^Horde^Wintergrasp^Commander Dardosh^Commander Dardosh^^^^Commander Dardosh in Wintergrasp Fortress wants you to slay 10 members of the Alliance.^Welcome to the Wintergrasp Fortress
column2: <name>. Warlord Garrosh demands one thing: Slay them all! Return to me when ten of the strongest members of the Alliance are dead.

column1: No Mercy for the Merciless^80^Alliance^Wintergrasp^Commander Zanneth^Commander Zanneth^^^^Commander Zanneth in Wintergrasp wants you to slay 10 members of the Horde.^Welcome to the Wintergrasp
column2: <name>. Your mission is simple. Defeat ten of the Horde's finest. Now
column3: go! Bring victory to the Alliance!

column1: Slay them all!^80^Horde^Wintergrasp^Commander Dardosh^Commander Dardosh^^^^Commander Dardosh in Wintergrasp wants you to slay 10 members of the Alliance.^Welcome to the Wintergrasp
column2: <name>. Warlord Garrosh demands one thing: Slay them all! Return to me when ten of the strongest members of the Alliance are dead.

column1: Victory in Wintergrasp^80^Alliance^Wintergrasp^Tactical Officer Ahbramis^Tactical Officer Ahbramis^^^^Win a Wintergrasp battleground match and return to Tactical Officer Abrahmis in Wintergrasp. You must have participated in the battle to be credited for the victory.^Commander Zanneth might be satisfied with a pile of Horde corpses at his feet
column2: but controlling Wintergrasp is of the utmost importance to the Valiance Expedition. Make sure it remains in our control. However
column3: don't think we'll just let you stand around while your allies do your dirty work for you. If you're not at least a second level recruit by the end of the battle
column4: don't come back.

column1: Don't Forget the Eggs!^74^All^Dragonblight^Kilix the Unraveler^Kilix the Unraveler^^^^Kilix the Unraveler in the Pit of Narjun wants you to enter Azjol-Nerub and destroy 6 Nerubian Scourge Eggs.^Throughout Azjol-Nerub
column2: the scourged nerubians carefully nurture eggs that will soon hatch
column3: providing them even greater numbers. It would do little good for the caverns to be cleansed of the undead that stain them if these fouled eggs were left to hatch and take their place. As you explore the expanse that was once Azjol-Nerub
column4: be sure to clear our ancient home of any scourge eggs you find.

column1: Victory in Wintergrasp^80^Horde^Wintergrasp^Tactical Officer Kilrath^Tactical Officer Kilrath^^^^Win a Wintergrasp battleground match and return to Tactical Officer Kilrath in Wintergrasp. You must have participated in the battle to gain credit for the victory.^While Dardosh might be content with slaying our foes
column2: it is of the utmost importance that we control Wintergrasp Fortress. Do whatever it takes to ensure Wintergrasp is ours. However
column3: don't think we'll just let you stand around while your allies do your dirty work for you. If you're not at least a second level recruit by the end of the battle
column4: don't come back.

column1: Stop the Siege^80^Horde^Wintergrasp^Lieutenant Murp^Lieutenant Murp^^^^Lieutenant Murp in Wintergrasp Fortress wants you to destroy 3 Alliance siege machines.^I hears dem! The Alliance come soon. Destroy three Alliance siege devices and come back to Murp.

Stop the Siege^80^Alliance^Wintergrasp^Senior Demolitionist Legoso^Senior Demolitionist Legoso^^^^Senior Demolitionist Legoso in Wintergrasp Fortress wants you to destroy 3 Horde siege machines.^It is only a matter of time before this castle is besieged by the forces of the Horde. Destroy three of their siege devices and return to me.

The Faceless Ones^76^All^Ahn'kahet: The Old Kingdom^Kilix the Unraveler^Kilix the Unraveler^^^^Kilix the Unraveler in the Pit of Narjun wants you to kill Herald Volazj and the three Forgotten Ones that accompany him in Ahn'Kahet.^In my peoples' struggle against the forces of the undead
column2: they dug deeper as they lost ground. In desperation
column3: they dug too deep. We inadvertently exposed a tendril of the old god's will
column4: which was made manifest in the creatures known only as the Faceless. In the end
column5: we could not fight on two fronts against such powerful enemies. Our misfortune cost us the war against the undead
column6: and ultimately
column7: our home. Enter Ahn'kahet
column8: <class>
column9: and cleanse our former home of these Faceless atrocities.

column1: Where Kings Walk^55^Alliance^Death Knight^Highlord Darion Mograine^King Varian Wrynn^^The Battle For The Ebon Hold^^Deliver the letter to King Varian Wrynn of the Alliance at Stormwind Keep in Stormwind City.^You are now
column2: and forever will be
column3: a Knight of the Ebon Blade
column4: <name>
column5: but know this: you were once a hero of the Alliance. <Darion stares at you.> This order must establish allies for itself if it is to survive. You must represent the Knights of the Ebon Blade to the Alliance. On the platform
column6: southeast of me
column7: is a portal to Stormwind City. Take this letter
column8: given to me on your behalf by Lord Fordring
column9: and deliver it to King Varian Wrynn. Use the portal.

column1: Warchief's Blessing^55^Horde^Death Knight^Highlord Darion Mograine^Thrall^^The Battle For The Ebon Hold^^Deliver the letter to Thrall
column2: Warchief of the Horde at Orgrimmar.^You are now
column3: and forever will be
column4: a Knight of the Ebon Blade
column5: <name>
column6: but know this: you were once a hero of the Horde. <Darion stares at you.> This order must establish allies for itself if it is to survive. You must represent the Knights of the Ebon Blade to the Horde. On the platform
column7: southeast of me
column8: is a portal to Orgrimmar. Take this letter
column9: given to me on your behalf by Lord Fordring
column10: and deliver it to Thrall. Use the portal.

column1: All Things in Good Time^80^All^Ahn'kahet: The Old Kingdom^Kilix the Unraveler^Kilix the Unraveler^^^^Kilix the Unraveler in the Pit of Narjun wants you to obtain an Ahn'kahar Watcher's Corpse and place it upon the Ahn'kahet Brazier in Ahn'kahet.^Ahn'kahet
column2: from whence we came... One day
column3: I dream
column4: we shall overcome the death and darkness that hold our ancient home in their grip. To that end
column5: I have a plan to weaken the resolve of our enemies. Their precious Watchers must burn! Take their corpses and place them upon the brazier deep within the city. The scent of their burnt remains will linger in the air
column6: reminding our enemy of their weakness. Be mindful
column7: <class>! Their undead corpses are most fragile and will deteriorate rapidly.

column1: Fueling the Demolishers^80^Horde^Wintergrasp^Siegesmith Stronghoof^Commander Dardosh^^^^Siegesmith Stronghoof at Wintergrasp Fortress wants you to retrieve 10 Eternal Embers from Alliance players in the Cauldron of Flames.^Lok'tar
column2: <name>! While the battle may be over
column3: we must prepare for the Alliance's next assault! Travel to the Cauldron of Flames in south eastern Wintergrasp and retrieve ten eternal embers. The embers are mixed in with coal to fuel the Demolishers and Siege Engines. We've heard reports of Alliance pigs collecting the embers all day. Slay them and take their embers! If they have already abandoned the area
column4: then be prepared to fight the fire elementals there until you find some!

column1: Warding the Walls^80^Horde^Wintergrasp^Hoodoo Master Fu'jin^Hoodoo Master Fu'jin^^^^Hoodoo Master Fu'jin at Wintergrasp Fortress wants you to retrieve 10 Enchanted Alliance Breastplates at the Glacial Falls.^Hey 'mon. This place be givin' me dah heebie jeebies
column2: don't cha know? Way too many spirits haunting dis place. I want ta be placing hoodoo wards up
column3: but I be needin' some souls
column4: mon. Not any soul though
column5: only da soul of a strong warrior could do da job. The Glacial Falls in east Wintergrasp be havin' dem special properties to extract da soul. Slay the Alliance there
column6: mebbe they be havin' the stuff we need. Bring back da armor of the slain. If there be no Alliance maybe da elementals got 'em
column7: mon.

column1: Bones and Arrows^80^Horde^Wintergrasp^Vieron Blazefeather^Vieron Blazefeather^^^^Lieutenant Vieron Blazefeather at Wintergrasp Fortress wants you to retrieve 10 Quivers of Dragonbone Arrows from Alliance players in the Forest of Shadows.^Why would they set me to the task of arming our archers? I was a poet
column2: not a ranger! Well
column3: no use complaining. <name>
column4: I am in need of dragon bone for our arrowheads. Travel to the Forest of Shadows on the western side of Wintergrasp. Ever since the last skirmish
column5: the Alliance have been scavenging dragon bones in the area. Slay them and take the bones. If that fails
column6: you might be lucky and get one from the spirits in the area. I hear they love to impale their living victims on the bones as they die.

column1: Healing with Roses^80^Horde^Wintergrasp^Primalist Mulfort^Primalist Mulfort^^^^Primalist Mulfort wants you to retrieve 10 Alliance Herb Pouches from Alliance players at the Steppe of Life.^Between the battles
column2: one might almost believe that there was hope for peace in this land. Sadly
column3: that is not to be our fate. Travel to the Steppe of Life in southwestern Wintergrasp. I have need of the roses that grow there for salve to treat the wounded. Sadly
column4: the rose has become scarce due to the Alliance harvesting it too rapidly. Slay them on the Steppe of Life and retrieve their herb pouches from the bodies. If that fails
column5: perhaps a lasher or two might have one.

column1: A Rare Herb^80^Alliance^Wintergrasp^Anchorite Tessa^Anchorite Tessa^^^^Anchorite Tessa in Wintergrasp wants you to retrieve 10 Horde Herb Pouches from Horde players in the Steppe of Life.^My
column2: it is quite chilly up here! Reminds me of the stormy peaks of Kaarinos on Argus. However
column3: with all of this snow and ice
column4: our soldiers can easily catch cold. Head to the Steppe of Life in southwestern Wintergrasp
column5: and bring me back 10 Horde Herb Pouches. I will grind the herbs into a medicine to protect against the cold. The Horde have been seen collecting them from the plant life in the area. Do not hesitate to slay them and retrieve the herbs! You may also find one on a lasher in the area.

column1: Bones and Arrows^80^Alliance^Wintergrasp^Bowyer Randolph^Bowyer Randolph^^^^Bowyer Randolph in Wintergrasp wants you to retrieve 10 Quivers of Dragonbone Arrows from Horde players at the Forest of Shadows.^Dragons are incredible! Well
column2: their bones at least! I've been equipping our archers with arrowheads made of Dragonbone. Unfortunately
column3: since the massacre at Angrathar
column4: it has become almost impossible to get bone from Dragonblight. However
column5: the Forest of Shadows on the western edge of Wintergrasp has enough bones to tide us over. Head to the Forest of Shadows and bring back any bone splinters you can find! The Horde have been seen collecting bone splinters in the area. Slay them!

column1: Fueling the Demolishers^80^Alliance^Wintergrasp^Siege Master Stouthandle^Commander Zanneth^^^^Siegesmith Stouthandle in Wintergrasp wants you to retrieve 10 Eternal Embers from Horde players at the Cauldron of Flames.^<name>! About time you showed up. While we may have lost the last battle
column2: we should prepare for the next! Travel to the Cauldron of Flames in southeastern Wintergrasp and retrieve several eternal embers. The embers are mixed in with coal to fuel the Demolisher and Siege Engines. Oh
column3: and if you happen to see some of the Horde in the Cauldron
column4: don't hesitate to slay them and take their embers. We must prevent them from holding the keep!

column1: Warding the Warriors^80^Alliance^Wintergrasp^Sorceress Kaylana^Sorceress Kaylana^^^^Sorceress Kaylana in Wintergrasp wants you to retrieve 10 sets of Imbued Horde Armor at the Glacial Falls.^<name>
column2: good to see you. We must prepare for our next assault on the fortress. My research indicates that the armor of soldiers recently slain in the Glacial Falls becomes imbued with an incredible amount of energy. The Horde has been collecting armor in the area. Head to the Glacial Falls and slay any of the Horde you find there. Return their imbued armor to me. If you cannot find any of the Horde
column3: you might find the armor of an adventurer slain by the elementals.

column1: Bones and Arrows^80^Horde^Wintergrasp^Vieron Blazefeather^Vieron Blazefeather^^^^Lieutenant Vieron Blazefeather in Wintergrasp wants you to retrieve 10 Quivers of Dragonbone Arrows from Alliance players at the Forest of Shadows.^Why would they set me to the task of arming our archers? I was a poet
column2: not a ranger! Well
column3: no use complaining. <name>
column4: I am in need of dragon bone for our arrowheads. Travel to the Forest of Shadows on the western side of Wintergrasp. Ever since the last skirmish
column5: the Alliance have been scavenging dragon bones in the area. Slay them and take the bones. If that fails
column6: you might be lucky and get one from the spirits in the area. I hear they love to impale their living victims on the bones as they die.

column1: Fueling the Demolishers^80^Horde^Wintergrasp^Siegesmith Stronghoof^Commander Dardosh^^^^Siegesmith Stronghoof in Wintergrasp wants you to retrieve 10 Eternal Embers from Alliance players at the Cauldron of Flames.^Lok'tar
column2: <name>! While the battle may have subsided
column3: we must prepare to retake the fortress! Travel to the Cauldron of Flames in south eastern Wintergrasp and retrieve ten eternal embers. The embers are mixed in with coal to fuel the Demolishers and Siege Engines. We've heard reports of Alliance pigs collecting the embers all day. Slay them and take their embers! If they have already abandoned the area
column4: then be prepared to fight the fire elementals there until you find some!

column1: Healing with Roses^80^Horde^Wintergrasp^Primalist Mulfort^Primalist Mulfort^^^^Primalist Mulfort in Wintergrasp wants you to retrieve 10 Alliance Herb Pouches from Alliance players at the Steppe of Life.^So many of our braves were lost during the battle
column2: but even more shall die if left untreated. Travel to the Steppe of Life in southwestern Wintergrasp. I have need of the roses that grow there for salve to treat the wounded. Sadly
column3: the rose has become scarce due to the Alliance harvesting it too rapidly. Slay them on the Steppe of Life and retrieve their herb pouches from the bodies. If that fails
column4: perhaps a lasher or two might be in bloom.

column1: Jinxing the Walls^80^Horde^Wintergrasp^Hoodoo Master Fu'jin^Hoodoo Master Fu'jin^^^^Hoodoo Master Fu'jin in Wintergrasp wants you to retrieve 10 Enchanted Alliance Breastplates from Alliance players at the Glacial Falls.^Hey 'mon. See dem Alliance sitting comfy in their keep? I think they be a bit too comfy
column2: ya? I want ta be jinxing the place
column3: but I be needin' some souls
column4: mon. Not any soul though
column5: only da soul of a strong warrior could do da job. The Glacial Falls in east Wintergrasp be havin' dem special properties to extract da soul. Slay the Alliance there
column6: they be havin' the stuff we need. Bring back da armor of the slain. If there be no Alliance maybe da elementals got 'em
column7: mon.

column1: Funky Fungi^76^All^Ahn'kahet: The Old Kingdom^Ooze-covered Fungus^Kilix the Unraveler^^^^You are to collect 6 Grotesque Fungus from Savage Cave Beasts in Ahn'kahet and deliver them to Kilix the Unraveler in The Pit of Narjun.^A misshapen piece of mushroom-like fungus falls from a particularly smelly
column2: ooze-covered patch of the cave beast's flesh. Examining it
column3: you are violently repulsed by its overwhelming stench. You wonder to yourself if this is the kind of thing that the nerubians might find appetizing. Placing the sticky organism in your pack
column4: you determine to find out...

column1: Disarmament^71^Alliance^Utgarde Keep^Defender Mordun^Defender Mordun^^^^Defender Mordun wants you to enter Utgarde Keep and steal 5 Vrykul Weapons^Take it from me
column2: <lad/lass>
column3: them vrykul weapons be downright nasty! I've felt their edge personally
column4: and there be somethin' unnatural about 'em. Deceptively well-balanced
column5: wickedly sharp - just plain deadly. Get into their stronghold and if nuthin' else
column6: pilfer some o' them weapons! Mebbe we can learn us a thing 'er two about 'em
column7: mebbe not. Bottom line - the fewer axes they be swingin' around
column8: the better.

column1: Disarmament^71^Horde^Utgarde Keep^Dark Ranger Marrah^High Executor Anselm^^^^Dark Ranger Marrah wants you to steal 5 Vrykul Weapons from Utgarde Keep and bring them to High Executor Anselm in Vengeance Landing.^We must discover the secret to these savages' weapons! If you'd have seen how easily they cut through my companions
column2: you'd understand my sense of urgency. Just have a look at their forge if you doubt my words. Scour the place. Gather all of their arms that you can carry and bring them to Anselm for his inspection. Do not fail us
column3: <class>. Every weapon you are able to bring out of this place is one less that we must face in the field.

column1: Halls of Stone^78^All^Halls of Stone^Brann Bronzebeard^Brann Bronzebeard^^^^Brann Bronzebeard wants you to accompany him as he uncovers the secrets that lie in the Halls of Stone.^Well now
column2: I'm surprised to see other adventurers in a place such as this! It so happens that I could use a bit o' company for what lies ahead. If my research on these halls is accurate
column3: there be monumental discoveries to be made here! Assumin' I can count on ya to watch my back
column4: you're welcome to tag along. So
column5: what'dya say
column6: <class>? Care ta join me?

column1: By Fire Be Purged^80^All^Icecrown^Crusader Olakin Sainrith^Crusader Olakin Sainrith^^^Killing Two Scourge With One Skeleton^Crusader Olakin Sainrith at Blackwatch wants you to burn 7 Festering Corpses using Olakin's Torch.^The Scourge uses our own fallen against us
column2: by raising them as ghouls or skeletons
column3: or by dismembering their corpses and using the parts to make abominations. This must stop! The dead are heroes who fell in defense of all the living
column4: and they cannot be confined to so grisly a fate. Moreover
column5: we cannot afford to face them again on the field
column6: used as weapons against us. Take this torch with you to the Fleshwerks
column7: and burn any of the corpses you find in the Sanctum of Reanimation or the abomination lab.

column1: He's Gone to Pieces^80^All^Icecrown^Darkrider Arly^Darkrider Arly^He's Gone to Pieces^Killing Two Scourge With One Skeleton^^Recover Olakin's Torso
column2: Olakin's Legs
column3: Olakin's Left Arm
column4: and Olakin's Right Arm and bring them to Darkrider Arly at Blackwatch.^With the abduction of Crusader Olakin
column5: the Argent Crusade's forces will have no commander in the final assault on the Fleshwerks. While one crusader is the same as any other to me
column6: the argents won't see it that way. I hate to see us waste time chasing after this
column7: but I have no choice. Our gallant crusader has likely been dismembered by now
column8: and his remains used to construct abominations. Go down into the Fleshwerks
column9: kill the corpulent horrors fighting our forces
column10: and recover Olakin's body parts.

column1: Battle at Valhalas^80^All^Icecrown^The Bone Witch^Geirrvif^The Sum is Greater than the Parts^^Battle at Valhalas: Fallen Heroes^Speak with Geirrvif in Valhalas.^I see and hear many things
column2: <name>
column3: and something very important has happened since your defeat of Overthane Balargarde: you are wanted for battle in Valhalas! You will find the battle pit to the north. Go now with your friends and speak with Geirrvif the val'kyr. The challengers that she will offer you within Valhalas are sure to require their help. Good luck.

column1: Battle at Valhalas: Fallen Heroes^80^All^Icecrown^Geirrvif^Gjonner the Merciless^^Battle at Valhalas^Battle at Valhalas: Khit'rix the Dark Ma^Geirrvif at Valhalas has challenged you to
column2: in a single combat
column3: defeat all six of the fallen heroes: Eldreth
column4: Geness Half-Soul
column5: Jhadras
column6: Masud
column7: Rith
column8: and Talla.^If you believe yourself ready to begin then I have just the match for you to cut your teeth on. Another group of outsiders thought themselves prepared for the rigors of Valhalas. They had much hubris
column9: but in the end they fell like all of the others. If you think yourselves so different -- if you think that you have the skill and experience to fight here amongst such storied warriors -- then please accept the challenge.

column1: Battle at Valhalas: Khit'rix the Dark Master^80^All^Icecrown^Geirrvif^Gjonner the Merciless^^Battle at Valhalas: Fallen Heroes^Battle at Valhalas: The Return of Sigrid^Geirrvif at Valhalas has challenged you to defeat Khit'rix the Dark Master.^A variety of beings travel the world to prove themselves within Valhalas. Some even come from under the world. Khit'rix the Dark Master is one such. Hailing from deep within the ground where insanity reigns
column2: Khit'rix has asked for someone exotic to face in the ring. You will do. Dare you face this Nerubian nightmare
column3: <race>?

column1: Battle at Valhalas: The Return of Sigrid Iceborn^80^All^Icecrown^Geirrvif^Gjonner the Merciless^^Battle at Valhalas: Khit'rix the Dark Ma^Battle at Valhalas: Carnage!^Geirrvif at Valhalas has challenged you to defeat Sigrid Iceborn.^An old foe of yours has returned: Sigrid Iceborn. Perhaps you remember besting her in a duel upon the Savage Ledge? No matter
column2: she certainly remembers you. She's insisting upon a chance to prove herself once more. Personally
column3: I think it's more a chance for revenge
column4: but that too can be useful in this place. I leave it up to you
column5: <name>. Will you face Sigrid Iceborn once more?

column1: Battle at Valhalas: Carnage!^80^All^Icecrown^Geirrvif^Gjonner the Merciless^^Battle at Valhalas: The Return of Sigrid^Battle at Valhalas: Thane Deathblow^Geirrvif at Valhalas has challenged you to defeat Carnage.^You've been successful up to this point
column2: <name>
column3: but what you must face to continue to battle within Valhalas is a gigantic horror beyond imagining. I must warn you to turn away now. Carnage is a mountain of flesh constructed by the Lich King's most fiendish minds. I do not see how you and your friends will defeat it. However
column4: the choice is yours.

column1: Battle at Valhalas: Thane Deathblow^80^All^Icecrown^Geirrvif^Gjonner the Merciless^^Battle at Valhalas: Carnage!^Battle at Valhalas: Final Challenge^Geirrvif at Valhalas has challenged you to defeat Thane Banahogg
column2: the Deathblow.^Your skills have not gone unnoticed by the vrykul of Jotunheim
column3: <name>. Thane Banahogg has taken a personal interest in you and has insisted that he be your next match. If you thought Carnage was bad
column4: then you might want to go home now. Thane Banahogg's nickname is The Deathblow. I think you can guess how he earned it. Do you accept the thane's challenge?

column1: Battle at Valhalas: Final Challenge^80^All^Icecrown^Geirrvif^Gjonner the Merciless^^Battle at Valhalas: Thane Deathblow^^Geirrvif at Valhalas has challenged you to defeat Prince Sandoval.^I'm afraid that your success is going to be your undoing
column2: <name>. <If the val'kyr could turn more white
column3: she would.> Word of your success in Valhalas has reached deep into Icecrown Citadel
column4: stirring one whom you have no desire to meet. Prince Sandoval himself is on his way at this very moment. Gjonner warned you that you should run and I cannot disagree. What will you do? He's on his way. Will you face the blood prince in final battle?

column1: Putting Olakin Back Together Again^80^All^Icecrown^Darkrider Arly^Darkrider Arly^He's Gone to Pieces^^^Obtain a Spool of Thread and the Doctor's Cleaver
column2: then take them to the Sanctum of Reanimation Slab and use Olakin's remains to attempt to reanimate the crusader. Return to Darkrider Arly at Blackwatch when this task is complete.^We can't afford to waste any time putting Olakin back together. Fortunately
column3: the Scourge has provided a perfect place for you to stitch him back together. Near the Fleshwerks' flesh giant lab is the Sanctum of Reanimation. Search the area for a spool of thread and the doctor's cleaver. Then
column4: take Olakin's remains to the large slab in the middle of the sanctum and get to work.

column1: I'm Not Dead Yet!^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Father Kamaros^Absalan the Pious^^Where Are They Coming From?^^Escort Father Kamaros to safety and then report to Absalan the Pious aboard the Skybreaker.^The Light smiles upon me. I have not yet died in this living nightmare
column2: but the Scourge will kill me and tear my body apart for use in their 'work' here if I cannot escape. I cannot make it on my own
column3: my child
column4: but with your help
column5: I may yet live to fight the Scourge again. Will you help me make my escape before the Scourge's butchers come to finish me off?

column1: Defend the Siege^80^Alliance^Wintergrasp^Senior Demolitionist Legoso^Senior Demolitionist Legoso^^^^Senior Demolitionist Legoso in Wintergrasp wants you to pilot or protect a siege device as it destroys three structures.^Front and center
column2: <name>! We're beginning our assault on Wintergrasp Fortress. Those Horde animals think they can hide cowardly behind their walls? Well
column3: I think not! We'll show them the power of Gnomish technology and smash their walls to bits! However
column4: even the most powerful siege device is helpless without a crew. Pilot or protect one of our siege vehicles as it destroys three of the Horde structures.

column1: Defend the Siege^80^Horde^Wintergrasp^Lieutenant Murp^Lieutenant Murp^^^^Lieutenant Murp in Wintergrasp wants you to defend or pilot a siege vehicle while they destroy three Alliance structures.^Dem Alliance won't be long to hold that keep. Murp would smash walls
column2: but Murp has to stay in camp. Murp wish he could smash Alliance who want to hurt Horde demolishers. You
column3: <name>! You go in Murp's place. Protect 3 siege vehicles while they smash Alliance buildings. Alliance not expect you to defend demolisher. Show Alliance how smart Murp is!

column1: Orgrim's Hammer^79^Horde^Icecrown^Warlord Hork Strongbrow^Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar^^^The Broken Front
column2: Get to Ymirheim!
column3: Slaves to Saronite
column4: Blood of the Chosen
column5: Joining the Assault^Seek out Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar aboard Orgrim's Hammer flying above Icecrown.^The Argent Crusade pulled my ravaged body from the Broken Front. What a glorious battle
column6: <race>. My axe sang as it cut down Alliance filth and Scourge alike. My time is over. It will be a good death. Carry a message for me
column7: soldier. Our base flies out of reach of Scourge - overhead between Mord'rethar and Aldur'thar. It is called "Orgrim's Hammer." <Hork futilely attempts to salute.> Fly high and avoid the Alliance juggernaut
column8: Skybreaker. Tell Korm... tell him I died... fighting... For the Horde.

column1: The Skybreaker^79^Alliance^Icecrown^Marshal Ivalius^High Captain Justin Bartlett^^^Exploiting an Opening^Seek out High Captain Justin Bartlett aboard the Skybreaker flying above Icecrown.^We were neck deep in Scourge and Horde. The screams of the dying covered that field. It was torturous... unrelenting! At some point my body gave out. I fell
column2: only to be awoken by the Argent Crusade. They pulled me out of the Broken Front and brought me here. I'm not going to make it. Grant a dying soldier one last wish
column3: <race>? Our base
column4: the Skybreaker
column5: flies high above Icecrown. It is there that you'll find my commanding officer
column6: High Captain Bartlett. Tell him that I died a soldier of the Alliance.

column1: Judgment Day Comes!^78^Alliance^Icecrown^Absalan the Pious^Highlord Tirion Fordring^^^^Report to Highlord Tirion Fordring at the Argent Vanguard in Icecrown.^We cannot defeat the Lich King on our own. Divided we shall all fall! I implore you to answer the call
column2: <brother/sister>. The Argent Crusade accepts all who would volunteer to aid in the war effort. Highlord Tirion Fordring himself awaits you at the Argent Vanguard! Get upon your mount and fly to the southeastern reaches of Icecrown. It is there that you will find Lord Fordring and the soldiers of the Argent Crusade. Go now
column3: <class>
column4: for judgment day comes!

column1: Judgment Day Comes!^78^Horde^Icecrown^Brother Keltan^Highlord Tirion Fordring^^^^Report to Highlord Tirion Fordring at the Argent Vanguard in Icecrown.^We cannot defeat the Lich King on our own. Divided we shall all fall! I implore you answer the call
column2: <brother/sister>. The Argent Crusade accepts all that would volunteer to aid in the war effort. Highlord Tirion Fordring himself awaits you at the Argent Vanguard! Get upon your mount and fly to the southeastern reaches of Icecrown. It is there that you will find Lord Fordring and the soldiers of the Argent Crusade. Go now
column3: <class>
column4: for judgment day comes!

column1: The Broken Front^80^Horde^Icecrown^Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar^Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar^^Orgrim's Hammer^Avenge Me!
column2: Make Them Pay!
column3: Good For Something?
column4: Takes One to Know One^Korm Blackscar on Orgrim's Hammer wants you to go to The Broken Front and question a Dying Berserker to discover what happened there.^What battle?! Those troops were on a recon mission! And what's this talk of Alliance - you're sure he said Alliance? Listen to me
column5: <name>! I need to know what's going on and I need to know NOW! Get yourself down there and get me some answers! Scour the battlefield and look for survivors - clues - anything!

column1: I'm Not Dead Yet!^80^Horde^Icecrown^Father Kamaros^Brother Keltan^^Where Are They Coming From?^^Escort Father Kamaros to safety and then report to Brother Keltan aboard Orgrim's Hammer.^The Light smiles upon me. I have not yet died in this living nightmare
column2: but the Scourge will kill me and tear my body apart for use in their 'work' here if I cannot escape. I cannot make it on my own
column3: <class>
column4: but with your help
column5: I may yet live to fight the Scourge again. Will you help me make my escape before the Scourge's butchers come to finish me off?

column1: Avenge Me!^80^Horde^Icecrown^Dying Berserker^Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar^^The Broken Front^^A Dying Berserker has asked that you slay 5 Dying Soldiers at the Broken Front. Report to Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar on Orgrim's Hammer when it is done.^I hear them
column2: <brother/sister>.... The moans of the wounded Alliance... they taunt me... Finish what we have begun here
column3: <class>. Show no mercy... let none of them survive. For... the Horde...

column1: The Broken Front^80^Alliance^Icecrown^High Captain Justin Bartlett^High Captain Justin Bartlett^^^^High Captain Justin Bartlett aboard the Skybreaker wants you to go to the Broken Front and question a Dying Soldier
column2: then report back to him.^What?! Noooo! We went to such great pains to keep this attack secret. How could the Horde have known? The resources... the men... all lost? Inconceivable! Our plans here in Icecrown hinged upon our taking that gate before the Horde could. We must recover quickly and prepare to mount another offensive. Visit the battlefield and search for any survivors. See if there's anything to be learned from this tragedy. And prepare yourself
column3: <name>
column4: for a war - on two fronts...

column1: Finish Me!^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Dying Soldier^High Captain Justin Bartlett^^^^A Dying Soldier in the Broken Front wants you to kill 5 Dying Soldiers and report to High Captain Justin Bartlett on the Skybreaker.^They taunt us - even as they lie dying here... Please
column2: <brother/miss>... Don't allow their mocking to be the last sounds I hear... Finish me... deliver me from this torment... into... the Light. Seek out my companions... offer them the same mercy. Leave nothing for the Scourge to raise! I beg you...

column1: No Mercy!^80^Alliance^Icecrown^High Captain Justin Bartlett^High Captain Justin Bartlett^^^^High Captain Justin Bartlett aboard the Skybreaker wants you to kill 15 Horde Players in Icecrown.^It is as I told you. They were not merely idle words spoken in a fit of anger. Time and again
column2: the Horde have demonstrated their disdain for everything we hold dear and holy. They must pay with their lives for their transgressions against the light. All of them. Just imagine a world free of their stain
column3: <name>. Envision the joy our children will know. Think of the reverence your descendants will have for your memory
column4: knowing they owe their happiness to you. Now go
column5: and make that vision a reality!

column1: Make Them Pay!^80^Horde^Icecrown^Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar^Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar^^The Broken Front^^Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar wants you to kill 15 Alliance Players in Icecrown.^The time has come! Too long have we suffered the company of the self-righteous Alliance! Too long have we stayed our hand from cleansing our world of the weak and the desperate. Now
column2: we bring an end to our humiliation! Now
column3: we show them the true meaning of fear! Now
column4: we bring honor to the Horde! Here
column5: at Icecrown
column6: we break the Alliance! Go
column7: <class>. Hunt them down. Break them. Take their will to live!

column1: The Flesh Giant Champion^80^All^Icecrown^Darkrider Arly^Darkrider Arly^He's Gone to Pieces^^^Speak with Margrave Dhakar at the western end of the Fleshworks to engage Morbidus. After you have defeated Morbidus
column2: report to Darkrider Arly at Blackwatch.^You've done well in destroying the Fleshwerks and slaughtering the Lich King's servants. Now
column3: all that remains is to defeat the Fleshwerks' greatest accomplishment -- the flesh giant known as Morbidus. It will not be an easy fight
column4: but the Shadow Vault has dispatched Margrave Dhakar with some reinforcements. Meet up with him at the highest point at the western end of the Fleshwerks. Tell him when you're ready to begin the attack and he'll order his forces into battle.

column1: Army of the Damned^80^Horde^Icecrown^Matthias Lehner^Matthias Lehner^Do Your Worst^^^Matthias Lehner at the First Legion Forward Camp wants you to raise an army of 100 Ghoulish Minions.^You probably think you're quite strong -- fighting these undead and crushing their bones beneath your war machines. That is nothing compared to the strength it took to create them. I saw the prince do it himself. I can show you how it happened... if you'd like.
Poke and Prod^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Koltira Deathweaver^Takes One to Know One^^That's Abominable!
column2: Against the Giants^Koltira Deathweaver aboard Orgrim's Hammer wants you to go the Broken Front and defeat 5 Hulking Abominations
column3: 5 Malefic Necromancers
column4: and 5 Shadow Adepts.^While your commander has his focus diluted by his loathing of your Alliance rivals
column5: you can depend on me to direct my attention squarely on the real enemy here - the Lich King and his minions. In order to hold any hope of conquering him at the citadel
column6: your people must take and hold each gate. For now
column7: let us focus on the first. Return to the front and prod their defenses. Look for any sign of weakness that we might exploit. I'll await your report
column8: <class>.

column1: Good For Something?^80^Horde^Icecrown^Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar^Chief Engineer Copperclaw^Good For Something?^The Broken Front^^Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar wants you to speak with Chief Engineer Copperclaw aboard Orgrim's Hammer.^Goblins! Hyper little busy-bodies... Listen
column2: <name>. Copperclaw
column3: our resident engineer
column4: is insisting that he's got something useful to show me. I'm in no mood to endure his squeaky nagging. The last time I acknowledged him
column5: he chirped on for an hour straight. It was all I could do to keep from drop-kicking him into Sindragosa's Fall! You go in my place and humor him. Let me know if indeed he's on to anything.

column1: Volatility^80^Horde^Icecrown^Chief Engineer Copperclaw^Chief Engineer Copperclaw^Good For Something?^^Volatility
column2: Green Technology^Chief Engineer Copperclaw wants you to use Copperclaw's Volatile Oil at the Broken Front to attract 3 Frostbrood Skytalons.^Where to begin... well
column3: you must know that as chief engineer of this vessel I have access to all of the intelligence reports - yes
column4: yes
column5: it's true
column6: and I've recently taken a particular interest in the frostwyrms you reported seeing to the south
column7: and I do believe I've developed a plan that just might work against them... now it'll take a little legwork on your part
column8: but essentially
column9: you build a dummy out of armor and coat it with a splash of this solution
column10: then run for cover! ...You still here
column11: <race>?

column1: Darkness Stirs^74^Horde^Dragonblight^Alexstrasza the Life-Binder^High Overlord Saurfang^Darkness Stirs^^^Gather Saurfang's Battle Armor from the field of battle and return it to High Overlord Saurfang at Warsong Hold in Borean Tundra.^Darkness stirs
column2: <name>. A tragic event has transpired that none but the Timeless One could have foreseen. Soon your people will be gripped by anger and hatred. War is on the horizon. The red dragonflight has done all that it can. What happens next is in the hands of the mortal races of Azeroth. Regrettably
column3: your journey begins with anguish. A father has lost a child today. You must bear the grim news. Gather the armaments of Saurfang and return them to the elder Saurfang.

column1: Herald of War^74^Horde^Borean Tundra^High Overlord Saurfang^Thrall^Darkness Stirs^^^Report to Thrall at Grommash Hold in Orgrimmar.^The Warchief needs you
column2: champion. Orgrimmar is in a state of martial law. All merchants and services have been shut down as the Warchief prepares for an unavoidable conflict. I cannot tell you much more - not now. Not in this place. The Warchief commands that our strongest champions report to his throne room. Go now
column3: <name>! Take the portal back to Orgrimmar and seek out Thrall.

column1: Opportunity^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Sergeant Kregga^Opportunity^^^Speak to Sergeant Kregga below Icecrown Citadel.^We recently came upon schematics that indicate a weakness in Icecrown Citadel. An opening in its defenses
column2: both figuratively and literally. The captured diagrams show an orifice leading several hundred feet into the ground. We're unsure of its purpose
column3: but our scouting has revealed it to be of high importance to the Scourge. Speak to Sergeant Kregga below Icecrown Citadel
column4: she's leading the attack on the site.

column1: Establishing Superiority^80^Horde^Icecrown^Sergeant Kregga^Sergeant Kregga^Opportunity^^^Sergeant Kregga at Icecrown Citadel wants you to slay 10 Hulking Horrors.^We've one shot at dealing some damage to this place -- let's make sure we get it right. We've acquired potent
column2: Scourge-made
column3: saronite bombs. But we must secure this area before we can set them off. We're going to need to get the Scourge defenses under control quickly
column4: before reinforcements arrive. Help my men out and come back when you're ready for some fireworks.

column1: Takes One to Know One^80^Horde^Icecrown^Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar^Koltira Deathweaver^Takes One to Know One^The Broken Front^^Sky-Reaver Korm wants you to speak to Koltira Deathweaver on Orgrim's Hammer.^While we should never miss an opportunity to strike out against the Alliance
column2: we mustn't forget about the Scourge. We won't have the numbers here to make a proper assault in the glacier for weeks
column3: but that won't keep us from learning all we can know about their defenses. I have asked our resident death knight to advise you in this effort. After all
column4: who better knows this enemy than they? Allow me to introduce Koltira Deathweaver.

column1: Volatility^80^Horde^Icecrown^Chief Engineer Copperclaw^Chief Engineer Copperclaw^^Volatility^^Chief Engineer Copperclaw wants you to use Copperclaw's Volatile Oil at the Broken Front to attract 3 Frostbrood Skytalons.^Wahooo! It works! Not that I had any doubts in my supernatural ingenuity
column2: only that I wasn't quite sure what kind of explosion to expect - let's just say I'm glad to see that you didn't get your eyebrows singed off. So now I just need to show ol' Korm how ya thaw out one 'a them wyrms. He'll hafta promote me to... to... to whatever comes after Chief Engineer! Here
column3: you take another batch of the stuff and head back out to the front and I'll go get Korm... Well? Move out!

column1: Blow it Up!^80^Horde^Icecrown^Sergeant Kregga^Saronite Bomb Stack^Opportunity^^^Go to the nearby Saronite Bomb Stack to light the fuse.^This is probably as under-control as this situation is going to get. Let's do this
column2: <name>. I need someone to light the fuse on those bombs and it looks like you're the one to do it.

column1: A Short Fuse^80^Horde^Icecrown^Saronite Bomb Stack^Pulsing Crystal^Opportunity^^Parting Gifts^Look for clues wherever the fall takes you.^As you light the fuse
column2: you notice that it is consumed by fire far quicker than you would expect. The bombs are about to go off and your best chance at surviving is to lean towards the pit and hope the fall doesn't kill you.

column1: That's Abominable!^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Koltira Deathweaver^^Poke and Prod^That's Abominable!
column2: Sneak Preview^Koltira Deathweaver on Orgrim's Hammer wants you to use the Abomination Reanimation Kit to create a Reanimated Abomination
column3: which you are to use to kill 15 Icy Ghouls
column4: 15 Vicious Geists
column5: and 15 Risen Alliance Soldiers.^Abominations... They can be a very capable enemy. I've seen them turn the tide of battle more than once. What few realize
column6: is that they can also be very capable friends. They are not deep thinkers. If you know the secrets of their creation
column7: you can issue them basic orders that they will not question. Fortunately for you
column8: I know these secrets. This kit will reanimate the remains of the abominations you defeat. Take it
column9: and learn to use them against the Scourge on the death gate.

column1: A Life Without Regret^74^Horde^Orgrimmar^Thrall^Vol'jin^Darkness Stirs^^^Take the portal to Undercity located in Grommash Hold and report to Vol'jin.^On the day of my death I wish to be able to say that I lived a life without regret. Those who mourn my passing will know that I was a Warchief who made decisions that best served his people. But this betrayal by Varimathras and Putress... All that we have worked for is for nothing. <Thrall's chest heaves with a heavy sigh.> Justice must be served. Portals to Undercity will be active momentarily. Vol'jin will be waiting for you. I will meet you there soon. Together we will make it right
column2: <name>.

column1: The Battle For The Undercity^74^Horde^Undercity^Vol'jin^Thrall^Darkness Stirs^^^Assist Thrall and Sylvanas in retaking the Undercity for the Horde.^The entirety of the Undercity is controlled by Varimathras. Our soldiers stand ready
column2: waiting for the Warchief to give the attack orders. Help the Horde take back the Undercity and earn your place among our greatest champions! Should you survive the assault
column3: report to Thrall. Check in with the Warchief when you are ready to begin.

column1: A Voice in the Dark^80^Horde^Icecrown^Pulsing Crystal^Matthias Lehner^Opportunity^^^Investigate the nearby voice in Naz'anak
column2: the Forgotten Depths.^The object is not a crystal at all
column3: but some form of organ
column4: encased in ice. As you touch it
column5: your hand reels in horrible pain. You feel as if your hand has been cut
column6: yet there is no visible wound. As you collect your thoughts
column7: you hear a young boy's voice nearby. "You really shouldn't have done that."

column1: Going After the Core^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Brann Bronzebeard^Brann Bronzebeard^Going After the Core^Norgannon's Shell^^Find Prospector Khrona's Notes and Prospector Soren's Maps at Brann's Base-Camp.^With Norgannon's Shell in hand
column2: only half of the archive key remains to be found. Luckily
column3: I've had the Explorers' League hard at work chasing down leads about the whereabouts of Norgannon's Core. Far to the southeast of the Inventor's Library
column4: on the slopes to the north of Dun Niffelem
column5: is a camp bearing my name. The Explorers' League representatives seeking the second half of the key are based there. Bring me the maps and the notes they've made and we should be able to track down the other key half.

column1: The Core's Keeper^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Brann Bronzebeard^Brann Bronzebeard^Going After the Core^^^Obtain Norgannon's Core.^Prospector Soren's notes say that Norgannon's Core is in the keeping of a sentinel named Athan
column2: one of Mimir's creations. Soren says the vault where Athan resides is called "Loken's Bargain" these days. Loken
column3: eh? The earthen have mentioned him. The vault is said to be southwest of the ruined Explorers' League camp
column4: with a round entrance on a mountainside overlooking the Valley of Ancient Winters. Find this Athan and get the core from him
column5: but I wouldn't be surprised if you were in for a fight.

column1: Time to Hide^80^Horde^Icecrown^Matthias Lehner^Matthias Lehner^Opportunity^^^Matthias Lehner wants you to obtain 3 Faceless One's Blood.^You shouldn't have touched it. But now that you did
column2: he's going to come looking for you. And he'll find you. Unless you hide yourself from him. Bring me blood from the faceless ones if you want to live!

column1: That's Abominable!^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Koltira Deathweaver^^That's Abominable!^^Koltira Deathweaver on Orgrim's Hammer wants you to use the Abomination Reanimation Kit to create a Reanimated Abomination
column2: which you are to use to kill 15 Icy Ghouls
column3: 15 Vicious Geists
column4: and 15 Risen Alliance Soldiers.^You know what to do
column5: <class>. Take this kit and use the guts from their abominations to create one of your own
column6: then command it to attack the enemy forces at the gate. You would do well to refine this tactic for when we make our assault on the gate.

column1: Against the Giants^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Koltira Deathweaver^Against the Giants^Poke and Prod^^Koltira Deathweaver on Orgrim's Hammer wants you to bring him 5 Pustulant Spines from the Pustulant Horrors on Mord'rethar.^While it's going to be crucial to defeat the Scourge on the ground
column2: we mustn't neglect the gate itself. The flesh giants on the ramparts are capable of hurling massive boulders and chunks of ice
column3: inflicting devastating damage to enemy infantry below. Muster a force and defeat these giants. We need to know just what we're up against in terms of their strength. Oh... and bring me their spines. If memory serves
column4: there's a little trick I can share with you.

column1: Coprous the Defiled^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Koltira Deathweaver^^^^Koltira Deathweaver aboard Orgrim's Hammer wants you to kill Coprous the Defiled at Mord'rethar.^Reports of a powerful zombie at the death gate have reached my ears
column2: <class>. We cannot allow a potential threat such as this to go unchallenged. Any information you are able to glean from engaging it will be better than what we know now. Go to the western chamber of the gate and find this creature. Fight him
column3: and find a weakness we might exploit.

column1: Basic Chemistry^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Koltira Deathweaver^Against the Giants^^Neutralizing the Plague^Koltira Deathweaver aboard Orgrim's Hammer wants you to use Pustulant Spinal Fluid on a plague cauldron at Mord'rethar.^<Koltira takes the pustulant spines and drains their fluid into a flask.> A little-known quality of the flesh giants... Their spinal fluid interacts with the plague in a very interesting way
column2: turning it into a corrosive acid. Poured from the towering ramparts
column3: acid may not be a welcome sight to the troops below
column4: but at least the victims won't rise up and add to the enemy's numbers. Pour the contents of this flask into one of the plague cauldrons in the western chamber of the death gate.

column1: King of the Mountain^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Frazzle Geargrinder^Frazzle Geargrinder^Get to Ymirheim!^^^Frazzle Geargrinder in Ymirheim wants you to use her Geargrinder's Jumpbot to plant the Alliance Battle Standard in the skulls at the top of the mountain.^You've just got to get my jumpbot to the tippy top of the mountain to the northwest here at Ymirheim pronto
column2: <name>! That dastardly
column3: no-good Blast Thunderbomb is working on his own bot
column4: and I'm afraid he almost has it completed. We're in a race to see who's gonna be king of the mountain! Once you jump up there
column5: plant our battle standard in the pile of bones and show everyone that the Alliance
column6: and my engineering skills
column7: are the best!

column1: Neutralizing the Plague^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Koltira Deathweaver^^Basic Chemistry^^Koltira Deathweaver aboard Orgrim's Hammer wants you use Pustulant Spinal Fluid on a blight cauldron at Mord'rethar.^You no longer need my assistance in neutralizing the enemy's plague cauldrons
column2: <race>. Hunt down the flesh giants at the death gate and use the fluid from their spines to render batches of the plague ineffective. You are striking at the heart of the enemy's strategy. This is an important mission - vital to our cause
column3: and should be carried out whenever time permits. Remember
column4: the giants and the plague cauldrons can be found on Mord'rethar.

column1: Return to the Surface^80^Horde^Icecrown^Matthias Lehner^Koltira Deathweaver^Opportunity^^^Return to Koltira Deathweaver aboard Orgrim's Hammer.^You should leave now. You'll find a portal behind me. It'll take you to the surface. We'll meet again. He'll be looking for you. It's only a matter of time until he finds you.

King of the Mountain^80^Horde^Icecrown^Blast Thunderbomb^Blast Thunderbomb^Get to Ymirheim!^^^Blast Thunderbomb in Ymirheim wants you to use his Thunderbomb's Jumpbot to plant the Horde Battle Standard in the skulls at the top of the mountain.^Yo
column2: <name>
column3: I need you to get my jumpbot to the top of this mountain to the southeast
column4: like yesterday! That girly
column5: self-righteous Frazzle Geargrinder thinks that her jumpbot's better than mine. Hah! We're in a race to see who's gonna be king of the mountain! Once you jump up there
column6: plant our battle standard in the pile of bones and show everyone that the Horde
column7: and my mad engineering skills
column8: are the best!

column1: Assault by Ground^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Skybreaker Squad Leader^Ground Commander Koup^^^^Escort the Skybreaker troops to the gates of Ymirheim. Return to Ground Commander Koup at the edge of the glacier east of Ymirheim for compensation after the task is complete.^Greetings <class>. Our troops have been attempting to storm Ymirheim for some time
column2: but these vrykul are far more vicious than any we've faced before. They've been ambushing us repeatedly as we try to make it up the pass
column3: and we've lost a lot of men. If you want to lend yourself to the battle and help get my squad to the gates of Ymirheim safely
column4: we will gladly reward you for your efforts. Once at the gates
column5: we'll dig in and wait for reinforcements to catch up to us.

column1: Forging the Keystone^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Brann Bronzebeard^Boktar Bloodfury^Going After the Core^^^Brann Bronzebeard wants you to meet him at the Temple of Invention and help him combine Norgannon's Shell and Norgannon's Core. Once you have helped Brann
column2: report back to Boktar Bloodfury at the Grom'arsh Crash-Site.^Aha! Here it is: the Temple of Invention
column3: the seat of Keeper Mimir himself! Of course
column4: that's where one would go to join the two parts of the key. According to the prospector's notes
column5: the Temple of Invention is one of the highest points on the western side of the Terrace of the Makers. That means it should be roughly east of your Grom'arsh Crash Site. I'll meet you at the temple and we'll combine the parts together.

column1: ...All the Help We Can Get.^80^Alliance^Icecrown^High Captain Justin Bartlett^Thassarian^...All the Help We Can Get.^^^High Captain Justin Bartlett aboard the Skybreaker wants you to speak to Thassarian.^Desperate times
column2: <class>... As uncomfortable as it makes me
column3: I'm prepared to accept assistance from anyone - including our resident death knight. Go to Thassarian and see if he can help us develop tactics against the Scourge that will ensure victory once we are able to mount another offensive. We have come so far... we must not fail here!

column1: Poke and Prod^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Thassarian^Thassarian^...All the Help We Can Get.^^^Thassarian on the Alliance gunship
column2: Skybreaker
column3: wants you to kill 5 Hulking Abominations
column4: 5 Malefic Necromancers
column5: and 5 Shadow Adepts at the Broken Front.^As someone of your experience must surely know
column6: there's no better way to familiarize one's self with their enemy than by confronting them in combat. While you no doubt lust for the glory of taking Icecrown Citadel
column7: that cannot happen without taking each of the Lich King's gates first. For now
column8: you must focus your efforts on the first of these... Return to the Broken Front. Engage the enemy in battle. Search for a weakness we might exploit and return to me with a detailed report.

column1: That's Abominable!^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Thassarian^Thassarian^^^^Thassarian on the Skybreaker wants you to use the Abomination Reanimation Kit to create a Reanimated Abomination
column2: which you are to use to kill 15 Icy Ghouls

column4: and 15 Risen Alliance Soldiers.^Abominations... They can be a very capable enemy. I've seen them turn the tide of battle more than once. What few realize

column6: you can issue them basic orders that they will not question. Fortunately for you
column7: I know these secrets. This kit will reanimate the remains of the abominations you defeat. Take it
column8: and learn to use them against the Scourge on the death gate.
