column1: Your Attention
column2: Please^80^Alliance^Icecrown^High Captain Justin Bartlett^Chief Engineer Boltwrench^Your Attention
column3: Please^^^High Captain Bartlett wants you to speak with Chief Engineer Boltwrench in the Skybreaker.^Chief Engineer Boltwrench has proven invaluable in his service aboard the Stormbreaker. Were it not for his ingenuity
column4: we'd be sprinkled across half of the glacier several times over by now. The thing is
column5: he feels he must share his every miniscule invention or discovery - most of which I don't even understand. My focus must be squarely on our enemies right now. I cannot afford any distractions. Please visit him in my stead
column6: <name>. And if you can
column7: assist him. You'll find him belowdecks.

column1: Borrowed Technology^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Chief Engineer Boltwrench^Chief Engineer Boltwrench^Your Attention
column2: Please^^The Solution Solution
column3: Killohertz^Chief Engineer Boltwrench aboard the Skybreaker wants you to use the Smuggled Solution at the Broken Front.^I get it
column4: I get it. Cappy's too busy to see this for himself. His loss! See
column5: I've managed to 'acquire' a certain shipment of solution from the enemy. And as much as I hate tinkerin' with inferior goblin technology
column6: I'm inclined to make an exception here. Take this sample. I'll need you to run a few field tests
column7: just to prove its usefulness
column8: while I try to do a little reverse engineering to duplicate the creation process. Go to the front and gather the materials to make a decoy
column9: then use the oil.

column1: The Solution Solution^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Chief Engineer Boltwrench^Chief Engineer Boltwrench^^Borrowed Technology^^Chief Engineer Boltwrench aboard the Skybreaker wants you to use the Smuggled Solution at the Broken Front.^Oh
column2: yes
column3: yes. Back again
column4: are we? Never enough practice
column5: I suppose. Here we are
column6: the solution to that pesky frostwyrm problem. Make them scarce
column7: <race>. The more you take out now
column8: the less we face when we are again ready to attempt our march on the citadel. Best of luck
column9: now. And do bring back whatever you don't use.

column1: Get to Ymirheim!^80^Horde^Icecrown^Chief Engineer Copperclaw^Blast Thunderbomb^Get to Ymirheim!^Orgrim's Hammer^^Speak with Blast Thunderbomb in Ymirheim.^You need to get down to Ymirheim
column2: that big frost vrykul town in the middle of Icecrown. Our boy
column3: Blast Thunderbomb
column4: is down there on the west side of town representing the Warsong Offensive in a competition against the Alliance. It's his jumpbot versus theirs in a king of the mountain contest! Don't let us down
column5: <name>. Goblin engineering pride is on the line! Besides
column6: all the boys here in the hold are counting on you. That and we've got money riding on it that you can kick those cowards in the pants!

column1: Slaves to Saronite^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Absalan the Pious^Absalan the Pious^^^^Absalan the Pious aboard the Skybreaker wants you to rescue 10 Saronite Mine Slaves.^Our people are being captured and put to work as slaves in the saronite mines of Ymirheim
column2: the vrykul stronghold in the middle of Icecrown. The Lich King has them mining that unholy ore day and night. I made a promise to Highlord Fordring that we would get those wretches out of there alive
column3: and that's exactly what we will do. Unfortunately
column4: I've been ordered to stay on this gunship and serve as an ambassador to the Valiance Expedition. Will you please rescue them in my stead
column5: <name>?

column1: Field Repairs^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Wrecked Demolisher^Opportunity^^Do Your Worst^Koltira Deathweaver aboard Orgrim's Hammer wants you to collect 5 Demolisher Parts from the Scavenging Geists in the Valley of Lost Hope and take them to the Wrecked Demolisher.^The Scourge is still reeling from our attack
column2: <name>. Now is the time to capitalize on our momentum. The strategically important valley below us is wide open. We've located a disassembled demolisher vehicle in what we believe is working condition in the southeastern corner of the Valley of Lost Hope area. If you can get the remaining parts from the Scourge scavengers
column3: you should be able to get it running again. A single working demolisher can wreak havoc on the enemy's ground units.

column1: Do Your Worst^80^Horde^Icecrown^Matthias Lehner^Matthias Lehner^Do Your Worst^Field Repairs^^Use the Refurbished Demolisher to destroy 150 Decomposed Ghouls
column2: 20 Frostskull Mages and 2 Bone Giants in the Valley of Lost Hope. Speak to Matthias Lehner at the First Legion Forward Camp when you've completed this task.^You're going to use this machine against the Scourge? You're not going to win against them like that. You can destroy hundreds... even thousands of them. But you won't win. Not out here. When you're done playing with your machine
column3: meet me to the north. There is an old army encampment. What I will show you will teach you a little bit about who you're up against.

column1: Raise the Barricades^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Koltira Deathweaver^^Need More Info^Bloodspattered Banners
column2: The Ironwall Rampart
column3: Blinding the Eyes in the Sky^Koltira Deathweaver
column4: aboard Orgrim's Hammer
column5: wants you to construct 8 Barricades using your Barricade Construction Kit.^When our forces begin to move beyond Aldur'thar
column6: they will be vulnerable to attack from the Ironwall Rampart and the broad glacier below. We have neither the time nor the materials to build fortifications
column7: but we can put up some barricades to shield our men from fire and break up Scourge charges. Take this barricade kit to the Valley of Fallen Heroes
column8: on the west side of Aldur'thar. Locate the markers I've placed there and use this kit to construct your barricades there.

column1: Bloodspattered Banners^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Koltira Deathweaver^^Raise the Barricades^Before the Gate of Horror^Koltira Deathweaver
column2: aboard Orgrim's Hammer
column3: wants you to kill 5 Scourge Banner-Bearers
column4: 5 Scourge Converters
column5: and 20 Converted Heroes.^In the Valley of Fallen Heroes and Icecrown Glacier
column6: to the west of Aldur'thar
column7: the Scourge seeks to use the fallen against us. Scourge lieutenants have woken the valley's dead and imbued them with fearsome strength and fervor. The banners carried by the Scourge leaders in the glacier area are the source of these powers. Kill the banner-bearers
column8: and you will weaken the converted heroes they lead. It falls to you to rid us of this obstacle
column9: and thin the resistance before the main body can advance.

column1: Mind Tricks^80^All^Icecrown^Darkspeaker R'khem^Darkspeaker R'khem^^^^Darkspeaker R'khem in the Saronite Mines wants you to recover the Foreman's Key to his chains.^<The creature speaks directly into your mind
column2: its thoughts painful and strange.> <race>-thing
column3: I am in need of your assistance. Like your enslaved friends
column4: I am a victim of the Lich King's ymirjar and their avarice. When I rose from below to investigate the noises coming from this cavern they captured and chained me. Will you please help me? The foreman of these mines holds the key to my chains. Kill him! <You can feel a pushing against your mind as if the creature is trying to coerce you.>

column1: Assault by Air^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Ground Commander Koup^Ground Commander Koup^^^^Ground Commander Koup at the edge of the glacier east of Ymirheim has ordered you to use the Skybreaker Suppression Turret to keep the Skybreaker Troop Transport alive long enough to make all of its drops.^I've got some boys suited and ready for their drops inside of Ymirheim. I could use you to see them there safely. Inside the walls
column2: the vrykul have set up some kind of automated spear guns that have been tearing up our transports. We had our engineers install a Suppression Turret to shut down those spear guns - just fire a round near any gun and the smoke should block its sight and clog its gears. Hop on the turret and see to it that all my boys make it to their drops in one piece.

column1: Assault by Air^80^Horde^Icecrown^Ground Commander Xutjja^Ground Commander Xutjja^^Joining the Assault^^Ground Commander Xutjja at the edge of the glacier north of Ymirheim has ordered you to use the Kor'kron Suppression Turret to keep the Kor'kron Troop Transport alive long enough to make all of its drops.^Alright scrub
column2: I've got something to keep you from being a complete waste. A unit of highly trained infiltrators is ready to be dropped inside of Ymirheim. The vrykul inside have automated spear guns that have been ripping our transports to shreds
column3: so we had the engineers on Orgrim's Hammer whip us up a suppression turret. You're the gunner. Launch rounds at their spear guns to obscure their vision and clog their gears. See to it that my men all make their drops and the transport stays in one piece.

column1: The Ironwall Rampart^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Koltira Deathweaver^^Raise the Barricades
column2: No Rest For The Wicked^Before the Gate of Horror^Defeat Grimkor the Wicked and return to Koltira Deathweaver aboard Orgrim's Hammer.^The Ironwall Rampart overlooks the Valley of Fallen Heroes
column3: west of Aldur'thar. The rampart dominates the fields below on all sides. We will not be able to advance if the rampart cannot be taken
column4: but it is held by Grimkor the Wicked and his Cult of the Damned disciples. If you can weaken Grimkor
column5: our forces know what to expect as we advance. Take this rune of distortion. Unleashing its power near Grimkor's orb at the end of the rampart should be enough to get the necromancer's attention.

column1: Blinding the Eyes in the Sky^80^Horde^Icecrown^Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar^Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar^^Raise the Barricades^Keeping the Alliance Blind^Use the SGM-3 to destroy 6 Skybreaker Recon Fighters
column2: then report back to Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar aboard Orgrim's Hammer.^The Alliance has somehow managed to field a squadron of recon vehicles over the Valley of Fallen Heroes and Icecrown Glacier
column3: the broad areas west of Aldur'thar. They cannot be permitted to take the lead in this fight. Chief Engineer Copperclaw has supplied me with the perfect weapon to deal with this threat -- he calls his new missile the SGM-3. I have his assurances that it will take out the Alliance flying machines in a single hit. Go and use this weapon to give us the upper hand.

column1: Get the Message^80^Alliance^Icecrown^High Captain Justin Bartlett^High Captain Justin Bartlett^^^^Capture 6 Orgrim's Hammer Dispatches from Orgrim's Hammer Scouts and bring them to High Captain Justin Bartlett aboard the Skybreaker.^The Horde is up to something and I don't like it. After the stunt they pulled on the Broken Front
column2: they're capable of anything
column3: and it's up to us to stop it. There's been a flurry of activity in the skies over the Icecrown Glacier
column4: to the west of Aldur'thar and the Ironwall Rampart. Horde scouts and messengers streak in and out on dragonhawks
column5: carrying reports and orders. Take this dart gun and use it to kill the Orgrim's Hammer Scouts. It'll probably work best if you're flying
column6: too.

column1: Sneak Preview^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Thassarian^Thassarian^^^^Thassarian
column2: aboard the Skybreaker
column3: wants you to fly down to the gate of desolation
column4: visiting the south
column5: central
column6: north

column8: but in the end

column1: The Guardians of Corp'rethar^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Koltira Deathweaver^^Before the Gate of Horror^^Koltira Deathweaver

column4: called the Horror Gate. It is the last barrier between us and the Icecrown Citadel. It waits to the south of the Ironwall Rampart
column5: beyond the glacier and the Conflagration. By the time our troops reach it
column6: they will be exhausted and worse. We must weaken its defenses
column7: or our army's strength will break upon its walls. Its battlements are manned by some of the Lich King's fiercest and most zealous servants. Do all you can to destroy these guardians and hope it is enough.

column2: aboard the Skybreaker

column5: you mentioned there were new cultists being trained. They're almost certain to be holding a special item given to all initiates - an Orb of Illusion. These artifacts are used to disguise a cult member
column6: allowing them to gain safe passage
column7: infiltrate
column8: or simply blend in with an enemy. Kill the fools until you find one
column9: <class>
column10: then use it on a subjugator.

column2: Overseer Savryn

column4: and Overseer Jhaeqon.^Based on your report
column5: and my knowledge of the Cult

column7: it will at least slow them down and keep them off-balance. And that
column8: <race>
column9: is a worthy enough goal for now. Seek out these overseers and return to me when they have been dispatched.

column1: Cannot Reproduce^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Thassarian^Chief Engineer Boltwrench^Cannot Reproduce^^^Thassarian aboard the Skybreaker wants you to use the Partitioned Flask at each of the 3 Cultists' Cauldrons at Aldur'thar
column2: then bring it to Chief Engineer Boltwrench.^I smell their cauldrons from here
column3: but that's not plague they're cooking. Pledges to the cult are forced to drink a concoction that steals their will and enslaves them forever to the Lich King. Some say the potion contains the twisted soul of a being who was tormented before being mercilessly slaughtered
column4: but I've never been able to reproduce it... Fill this flask with a sample from each of the three cauldrons in the northwest region of the gate and bring it to Chief Engineer Boltwrench.

column1: Retest Now^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Chief Engineer Boltwrench^Chief Engineer Boltwrench^Cannot Reproduce^^^Chief Engineer Boltwrench aboard the Skybreaker wants you to throw a Writhing Mass into a cauldron at Aldur'thar.^This should do the trick! Those twisted hooligans are looking for souls to put in their crazy-juice? Then I say we help 'em out a bit! Take a swig of this - don't worry
column2: I've diluted it plenty... I'm almost positive that its only effect will be to detect any cultist's essence once you've defeated them. When you've collected a bunch of them
column3: throw the writhing mass of twisted souls into any of their cauldrons. Let's see how they like a taste of their own medicine!

Then let's help 'em out a bit! Take a swig of this - don't worry
column3: I've diluted it plenty... I'm almost positive that its only effect will be to detect any cultist's essence. Once you've collected a bunch of 'em

column2: the Broken Shard of Despair
column3: and the Broken Shard of Suffering to Koltira Deathweaver aboard Orgrim's Hammer.^Atop the battlements of Corp'rethar
column4: the Lich King's minions have erected three crystals
column5: the shards of horror
column6: despair
column7: and suffering. Should our men reach the walls of Corp'rethar
column8: he will unleash these weapons on our army. In full effect
column9: the crystals will afflict the minds of our men with paralyzing pain and fear. Then
column10: the Scourge will be able to slaughter them at will. Find these shards
column11: destroy them
column12: and bring me their broken remains. We cannot allow the Lich King to deploy these weapons!

column1: Before the Gate of Horror^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Koltira Deathweaver^^Bloodspattered Banners
column2: The Ironwall Rampart^The Guardians of Corp'rethar
column3: Shatter the Shards^Koltira Deathweaver
column4: aboard Orgrim's Hammer
column5: wants you to use the Volatile Acid to dissolve the remains of 6 Skeletal Reavers.^The Conflagration
column6: the ground before Corp'rethar
column7: south of the Ironwall Rampart
column8: is where the Lich King's elite soldiers have formed up to defend the citadel. Led by a contingent of death knights
column9: a legion of skeletal reavers bars the way. I fear that even when these reavers fall
column10: the Scourge will simply reconstitute them and send them back at us. I've come up with a plan to stop this
column11: but I have no way of knowing if it will work. Take this solution and use it to dissolve the remains of the reavers.

column1: Blood of the Chosen^80^Horde^Icecrown^Warbringer Davos Rioht^Warbringer Davos Rioht^^Orgrim's Hammer^^Warbringer Davos Rioht on Orgrim's Hammer has sent you to kill 20 vrykul in Ymirheim.^Those vrykul that have gained the favor of the Lich King call themselves the Ymirjar. They inhabit a city in the center of Icecrown. We have a lot of preparations to make before we assault Icecrown Citadel
column2: and the one that stands before us now is routing these so-called "Chosen" of the Lich King. Go to their city
column3: Ymirheim
column4: and slaughter them in their home. Let there be no questions as to who the stronger combatants are here.

column1: Keeping the Alliance Blind^80^Horde^Icecrown^Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar^Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar^^Blinding the Eyes in the Sky^^Use the SGM-3 to destroy 6 Skybreaker Recon Fighters
column2: then report back to Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar aboard Orgrim's Hammer.^The Alliance is tenacious
column3: I'll give them that
column4: but it'll take more than that to stop us. Take this SGM-3 with you and shoot down the Skybreaker's recon fighters once again. I doubt the message will get through their thick skulls
column5: but there are enough missiles to keep trying to get our point across. Go and find their fighters flying above the Valley of Fallen Heroes
column6: west of Aldur'thar
column7: and don't come back until you've made wreckage of them.

column1: Raise the Barricades^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Thassarian^Thassarian^^^^Thassarian
column2: aboard the Skybreaker
column3: wants you to construct 8 Barricades using your Barricade Construction Kit.^When our forces begin to move beyond Aldur'thar
column4: they will be vulnerable to attack from the Ironwall Rampart and the broad glacier below. We have neither the time nor the materials to build fortifications
column5: but we can put up some barricades to shield our men from fire and break up Scourge charges. Take this barricade kit to the Valley of Fallen Heroes
column6: on the west side of Aldur'thar. Locate the markers I've placed there and use this kit to construct your barricades there.

column1: Capture More Dispatches^80^Alliance^Icecrown^High Captain Justin Bartlett^High Captain Justin Bartlett^^^^Capture 6 Orgrim's Hammer Dispatches from Orgrim's Hammer Scouts and bring them to High Captain Justin Bartlett aboard the Skybreaker.^Despite our efforts
column2: the Horde continues to send scouts to the area of the Icecrown Glacier
column3: to the west of the Ironwall Rampart and Aldur'thar. We can't afford to let the Horde gain the upper hand with this scouting operation. Take the dart gun with you again and show the Orgrim's Hammer scouts no mercy! Bring the captured dispatches to me. The Horde's wasted efforts will be our gain.

column1: Bloodspattered Banners^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Thassarian^Thassarian^^^^Thassarian
column2: aboard the Skybreaker
column3: wants you to kill 5 Scourge Banner-Bearers
column4: 5 Scourge Converters
column5: and 20 Converted Heroes.^In the Valley of Fallen Heroes and Icecrown Glacier
column6: to the west of Aldur'thar
column7: the Scourge seeks to use the fallen against us. Scourge lieutenants have woken the valley's dead and imbued them with fearsome strength and fervor. The banners carried by the Scourge leaders in the glacier area are the source of these powers. Kill the banner-bearers
column8: and you will weaken the converted heroes they lead. It falls to you to rid us of this obstacle
column9: and test the resistance before the main body can advance.

column2: west of Aldur'thar. The rampart dominates the fields below on all sides. We will not be able to advance if the rampart cannot be taken
column3: but it is held by Grimkor the Wicked and his Cult of the Damned disciples. If you can weaken Grimkor
column4: our forces will know what to expect as we advance. Take this rune of distortion. Unleashing its power near Grimkor's orb at the end of the rampart should be enough to get the necromancer's attention.

column1: Joining the Assault^80^Horde^Icecrown^Warbringer Davos Rioht^Ground Commander Xutjja^^Orgrim's Hammer^Assault by Ground
column2: Assault by Air^Report to Ground Commander Xutjja at the edge of the glacier north of Ymirheim.^We need more men to join the main assault on Ymirheim. Any warrior with half a brain can tell you that vrykul are fierce fighters and should not be taken lightly. That goes two-fold for the Ymirjar. They have shown us no restraint in proving why the Lich King deemed them worthy. Ground Commander Xutjja is overseeing the assault. The city itself is located in the center of Icecrown - Xutjja's troops are positioned near the edge of the glacier
column3: north of the city.

column1: Joining the Assault^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Knight-Captain Drosche^Ground Commander Koup^^^^Report to Ground Commander Koup at the edge of the glacier east of Ymirheim.^We need more men to join the main assault on Ymirheim. Any warrior with half a brain can tell you that vrykul are fierce fighters and should not be taken lightly. That goes two-fold for the Ymirjar. They have shown no restraint in proving to us why the Lich King deemed them worthy. Ground Commander Koup is overseeing the assault. The city itself is located in the center of Icecrown - Koup's troops are positioned near the edge of the glacier
column2: east of the city.

column1: Not a Bug^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Thassarian^Thassarian^^^^Thassarian
column2: aboard the Skybreaker
column3: wants you to collect 5 Dark Matters and summon a Dark Messenger at Aldur'thar.^Alright
column4: <friend/missy>
column5: time to plant a bug. Relax
column6: it's not a bug exactly
column7: but it'll serve our purposes. In the northern portion of Aldur'thar the cult's void summoners enslave demonic minions. Use this rod to siphon the dark matter from the corpses of these enslaved minions
column8: and then use their summoning crystal to bring our little spy into being. Until it is discovered
column9: the messenger will serve as our eyes and ears
column10: discreetly observing the actions of our enemy.

column1: Mystery of the Infinite
column2: Redux^80^All^Dragonblight^Chromie^Chromie^^Mystery of the Infinite^^Chromie
column3: at the top of Wyrmrest Temple
column4: has asked you to travel once more to the Bronze Dragonshrine.^There you are! Or
column5: were we just talking? <Chromie muses over the temporal possibilities.> Anyway
column6: the Infinites are after you! Well
column7: not you per-se. Rather
column8: they're after the past version of you that defended the Hourglass of Eternity. You remember
column9: right? That was you back then
column10: except it's you now too. Wait
column11: that's not important. What is important is that you head back to the Bronze Dragonshrine and defend yourself and the hourglass from their attacks before you get erased from history!

column1: Not a Bug^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Thassarian^Thassarian^^^^Thassarian
column2: aboard the Skybreaker
column3: wants you to collect 5 Dark Matters and summon a Dark Messenger at Aldur'thar.^The cultists have discovered the last messenger you summoned
column4: <race>. While it was quite informative
column5: it's important that we continue to monitor their every move. Use this rod to siphon the dark matter from the corpses of enslaved minions at Aldur'thar. Then use their summoning crystal to bring another dark messenger into being. Until it is discovered
column6: the messenger will serve as our eyes and ears
column7: discreetly observing the actions of our enemy.

column1: Need More Info^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Thassarian^Thassarian^Need More Info^^^Thassarian
column2: aboard the Skybreaker
column3: wants you to collect the 3 pages of Cultists' Research from the Cult Researchers at Aldur'thar and use them to create the Cult of the Damned Thesis.^The Cult of the Damned are notorious for concocting grandiose plans that in the end
column4: rarely succeed. But something feels different this time.... Perhaps it's the proximity to the Lich King that has their fervor heightened. Whatever it is
column5: they appear to be more confident than ever. We must know what feeds this bravado and then find a way to strip them of it! I believe the key lies with their researchers. Find out what they're up to and report back to me with the details.

column1: No Rest For The Wicked^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Thassarian^Thassarian^Need More Info^^^Thassarian
column2: aboard the Skybreaker
column3: wants you to defeat Alumeth the Ascended at Aldur'thar.^These fools have actually stumbled upon something that could pose a serious threat to our plans! The leader of this particular sect
column4: Alumeth
column5: has ritualistically sacrificed himself and now his underlings are channeling power to his soul. If he's allowed to rest
column6: their efforts will soon transform him into a mighty adversary. Combine his heart
column7: skull
column8: scepter and robes from around their chamber and use his remains on the crystal there. Hurry
column9: <race>! Destroy him before he becomes any more powerful!

column1: Reborn From The Ashes^74^Alliance^Dragonblight^Alexstrasza the Life-Binder^King Varian Wrynn^Reborn From The Ashes^^^Gather Fordragon's Shield from the field of battle at Angrathar the Wrath Gate and return it to King Varian Wrynn at Stormwind Keep in Stormwind City.^Our fate is emblazoned upon our souls at birth. Bolvar's fall
column2: while tragic
column3: was unavoidable. All that you can do now is honor your hero
column4: <name>. Collect Bolvar's shield from the field of battle and return it to your king. When you present the shield to Varian
column5: tell him this: "All is not lost. From the ashes of the fallen will rise a force that will unite nations and purge the evil from this world." He mustn't lose faith. Go now
column6: <name>. Your people need a hero. They need you.

column1: Futility^80^Horde^Icecrown^Matthias Lehner^Koltira Deathweaver^Do Your Worst^^^Return to Koltira Deathweaver aboard Orgrim's Hammer.^Do you see now? Sending your men against the prince's armies just swells their numbers. I don't expect you to understand... you'll probably just end up like the others. You'd best return to whoever sent you. They might be worried.
Cradle of the Frostbrood^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Koltira Deathweaver^Do Your Worst^^Where Dragons Fell^Koltira Deathweaver aboard Orgrim's Hammer wants you to slay 5 Wyrm Reanimators
column2: 8 Cultist Corrupters and 3 Vrykul Necrolords at Sindragosa's Fall.^We need to keep our momentum going. Let's not give the Scourge forces any respite. Sindragosa's Fall lies east just beyond the Valley of Lost Hope. The Cult of the Damned operate there
column3: under close supervision of the Lich King's undead vrykul lackeys. It is a place of great power
column4: possibly a blue dragonflight graveyard. The feared frostbrood are raised there from the bones of blue dragons. An attack there would have great impact on the enemy's access to frost wyrms. Are you up to it
column5: <name>?

column3: north of Icecrown Citadel and you can see for yourself.

column1: The Hunter and the Prince^80^Horde^Icecrown^Matthias Lehner^Matthias Lehner^Time for Answers^^^Matthias Lehner in the Court of Bones wants you to look for a Bloodstained Stone and complete the Prince's Destiny.^Before the prince became a king

column3: you'll understand everything. Find a bloodstained stone and pick it up from the floor. You'll see what happened.

column1: Argent Aid^80^Horde^Icecrown^Koltira Deathweaver^Highlord Tirion Fordring^Argent Aid^Knowledge is a Terrible Burden^^Speak to Highlord Tirion Fordring at the Crusader's Pinnacle.^There were rumors about the events you speak of among the death knights. I always expected the story to be more... symbolic. We must warn others
column2: but we must be discreet. As soon as the Lich King knows we're making our move
column3: he'll move the location of the heart -- we'll never get a chance like this again. The Horde and the Alliance have been infiltrated by the Cult of the Damned before. The Ebon Blade operates too close to the Scourge. We have to speak to Tirion Fordring and his Argent Crusade.

column1: Tirion's Gambit^80^Horde^Icecrown^Highlord Tirion Fordring^Highlord Tirion Fordring^Argent Aid^^^Tirion Fordring
column2: at the Crusader's Pinnacle
column3: wants you to obtain and wear a Cultist Acolyte's Hood and meet him at the entrance of the Cathedral of Darkness
column4: northwest of Icecrown Citadel.^Just this morning
column5: my scouts informed me of a Cult of the Damned procession leaving from Icecrown Citadel to the Cathedral of Darkness
column6: bearing an artifact. And now I learn that it might be Arthas's own heart... a thing containing the last bit of his remaining humanity. This is a sign of the Light. As long as such an artifact exists
column7: there is a chance that Arthas Menethil can become a man again! Meet me at the cathedral's entrance. Be sure to bring a cultist's hood -- we're going incognito.

column6: the messenger will serve as our eyes and ears
column7: discreetly observing the actions of our enemy.

column5: they appear to be more confident than ever. We must know what feeds this bravado and then find a way to strip them of it! I believe the key lies with their researchers. Find out what they're up to and report back to me with the details.

column8: skull
column9: scepter and robes from around their chamber and use his remains on the crystal there. Hurry
column10: <race>! Destroy him before he becomes any more powerful!

column3: died in defense of our world. The Horde is saddened by the loss of such a great hero
column4: but the Horde was not responsible for the cowardly attacks made by Putress at the Wrath Gate. We have also lost mighty heroes because of this betrayal. Tell your king that we will do everything in our power to bring the perpetrators of this cowardly act to justice. We will do all that we can to avoid conflict with the Alliance
column5: but we will not hesitate to defend ourselves if provoked.

column2: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder. Seek her counsel atop Wyrmrest Temple in the Dragonblight.

What do you say
column4: <name>?

column1: Securing the Perimeter^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Captain Kendall^Captain Kendall^Exploiting an Opening^^^Captain Kendall at Icecrown Citadel wants you to slay 10 Hulking Horrors.^The saronite bombs are in place

column2: below Icecrown Citadel

column2: the Forgotten Depths.^The object is not a crystal at all

column4: encased in ice. As you touch it

column6: yet there is no visible wound. As you collect your thoughts

column5: you'll be a little outnumbered

column10: including and not limited to
column11: the raising of frost wyrms. I need you to go kick their teeth in. I hate cultists.

column1: Hellfire Fortifications^60^Alliance^Death Knight^Warrant Officer Tracy Proudwell^Warrant Officer Tracy Proudwell^^Expedition Point^Hellfire Fortifications^Capture the Overlook
column2: the Stadium and Broken Hill
column3: then return to Warrant Officer Tracy Proudwell in Honor Hold in Hellfire Peninsula.^The Hellfire Citadel wages constant battles with our forces. We are holding our own so far
column4: but we can't yet launch a real offensive against them. To do that
column5: we need forward staging areas. Our scouts identified three fortifications near Hellfire Citadel. We want you to help secure these forts. Capture each fort
column6: and then report back to me. May fortune shine upon you in the conflicts ahead
column7: <name>
column8: for you will no doubt clash with Horde forces eager to gain these same fortifications.

column1: Hellfire Fortifications^60^Horde^Death Knight^Battlecryer Blackeye^Battlecryer Blackeye^^Felspark Ravine^Hellfire Fortifications^Capture the Overlook
column2: the Stadium and Broken Hill
column3: then return to Battlecryer Blackeye in Thrallmar.^The fel orcs of Hellfire Citadel must be scoured from our birthland! To attack them
column4: we must first secure forward staging points near the Citadel. Our outrunners found three fortifications that will suit this purpose
column5: but the Alliance has the same idea and even now sends forces to take them! We want you to stop the Alliance and capture these forts. Aid in the capture of each fort and then return to me. For the Horde!

column1: Corastrasza^80^All^Borean Tundra^Librarian Serrah^Corastrasza^Corastrasza^^^Librarian Serrah wants you to speak to Corastrasza in Coldarra.^Greetings
column2: <class>. Might I impose on you for a favor? Corastrasza is the sister of Raelorasz - the red dragon in charge of our outpost here. Against his will
column3: she has ascended to one of the upper rings of the Nexus to observe some frighteningly powerful blue drakes. Though he will never say it
column4: he worries about her
column5: and would welcome any news of her well-being. Please seek her out. Ask her to put her pride aside and send word to her brother.

column1: Aces High!^80^All^Borean Tundra^Corastrasza^Corastrasza^Corastrasza^^Aces High!^Corastrasza on the upper ring of the Nexus in Coldarra wants you to ride her drake and kill 5 Scalesworn Elites.^You possess the courage to draw so near to Malygos' lair
column2: mortal? Or is it simply ignorance? Soon we shall know.... I am a seasoned trainer of the graceful drakes of the red dragonflight. My business here is to study the enemy and teach my precious pets the tactics that will be most effective when we face the master of the blues. To demonstrate your nerve and ability
column3: I will allow you to ride one of my drakes against the enemy's minions. The opportunity is yours for the asking...

column1: Aces High!^80^All^Borean Tundra^Corastrasza^Corastrasza^^Aces High!^^Corastrasza on the upper ring of the Nexus in Coldarra wants you to ride her drake and kill 5 Scalesworn Elites.^Again we meet
column2: <race>. I confess
column3: your presence is beginning to grow on me. Am I correct in assuming that you've come to hone your aerial combat skills? As always
column4: my pets stand ready to bring fiery destruction to the enemy. Speak
column5: and they shall be at your disposal.

column1: The Library Console^80^Alliance^The Storm Peaks^Brann Bronzebeard^Inventor's Library Console^Sniffing Out the Perpetrator^^^Take the Inventor's Disk to the Inventor's Library Console inside the Inventor's Library.^Norgannon's shell is within our reach
column2: <name>. Take the inventor's disk into the library's interior. There should be a console there that you can activate with the disk. I imagine Mimir stored more there than just Norgannon's shell. There are probably enough schematics stored there to keep Ironforge's engineers occupied for years! Anyway
column3: use the disk to recover the shell. Hopefully
column4: Mimir hasn't decided to put any more obstacles in our way.

column1: The Library Console^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Brann Bronzebeard^Inventor's Library Console^Catching up with Brann^^^Take the Inventor's Disk to the Inventor's Library Console inside the Inventor's Library.^Norgannon's shell is within our reach
column2: <name>. Take the inventor's disk into the library's interior. There should be a console there that you can activate with the disk. I imagine Mimir stored more there than just Norgannon's shell. There are probably enough schematics stored there to keep Ironforge's engineers occupied for years! Anyway
column3: bring the disk to the console. Hopefully
column4: Mimir hasn't decided to put any more obstacles in our way.

column1: Preparations for War^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Officer Van Rossem^High Captain Justin Bartlett^^^^Speak to Officer Van Rossem to secure passage to the Skybreaker in Icecrown
column2: and then report to High Captain Justin Bartlett.^You there! You look like you have some wits about you. We could use some more able bodies in Icecrown. You may have heard rumors of our failure in assaulting the glacier from the ground
column3: but let me set those concerns to rest. We're now mounting our assault from one of the most advanced pieces of engineering known to Azeroth
column4: the Skybreaker. The Horde don't stand a chance
column5: and neither does Arthas. Speak to me when you're ready to depart.

column1: Preparations for War^80^Horde^Icecrown^Sky-Reaver Klum^Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar^^^^Speak to Sky-Reaver Klum to secure passage to Orgrim's Hammer in Icecrown
column2: and then report to Sky-Reaver Korm Blackscar.^You there! You look like you have some wits about you. We could use some more able bodies in Icecrown. The Alliance scum rushed into Icecrown ahead of us
column3: unprepared
column4: and got just what they deserved for their impatience. We took our time
column5: we made ready
column6: and soon we will mount a true assault from one of the most advanced pieces of engineering known to Azeroth - Orgrim's Hammer. The Alliance don't stand a chance
column7: and neither does Arthas. Speak to me when you're ready to depart and lend a hand.

column1: Everfrost^77^All^The Storm Peaks^Everfrost Chip^Calder^^^Remember Everfrost!^You are to return to Dun Niffelem and ask Calder about the piece of Everfrost.^This piece of ice has been submitted to immense pressures and exposed to natural magics from deep beneath the world's surface. In combination
column2: these effects have yielded an ice that will never melt. Knowing little of these things
column3: you resolve to bring the sample back to Dun Niffelem. Someone there is bound to be familiar with its properties.

column1: Maintaining Discipline^79^All^The Storm Peaks^Gretta the Arbiter^Gretta the Arbiter^^The Drakkensryd^^Gretta the Arbiter in Brunnhildar Village wants you to use the Disciplining Rod on 6 Exhausted Vrykul inside the Forlorn Mine.^You've succeeded where others have failed. Yet you cannot rest on your laurels. You must show others what strength and commitment really mean. The male insubordinates inside the Forlorn Mine need to be disciplined once again. Show them sister... show them what it means to disobey us.

Defending Your Title^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Gretta the Arbiter^Gretta the Arbiter^^The Drakkensryd^^Gretta the Arbiter in Brunnhildar Village wants you to defeat 6 Victorious Challengers.^Everyone's impressed by your performance
column2: sister. But do not let your guard down -- every new challenger with delusions of grandeur is going to come out swinging for your title of Hyldskvinnar. Show these upstarts what you're made of.

column1: Back to the Pit^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Gretta the Arbiter^Gretta the Arbiter^^Into the Pit^^Gretta the Arbiter
column2: in Brunnhildar Village
column3: wants you to use the Reins of the Warbear Matriarch inside the Pit of the Fang and defeat 6 Hyldsmeet Warbears.^To truly stay in your best riding shape you'll want to test yourself against the other Hyldnir every day. Head back into the Pit of the Fang and show them what you're capable of. They'll appreciate suffering defeat to one as skilled as yourself.

column1: The Aberrations Must Die^80^All^The Storm Peaks^Gretta the Arbiter^Gretta the Arbiter^^Aberrations^^Gretta the Arbiter in Brunnhildar Village wants you to go to Valkyrion and obtain Vials of Frost Oil from the Valkyrion Aspirants. Use the Vials of Frost Oil to destroy 30 Plagued Proto-Drake Eggs.^It is not enough to demonstrate your prowess among your peers. You must also fight our enemies
column2: dear sister. The Valkyrion traitors continue to mock our noble drake-riding traditions by rearing plagued proto-drakes. Seize the frost oil they wield and use it to freeze their abominable plagued eggs.

column1: Xarantaur
column2: the Witness^80^Horde^The Storm Peaks^Boktar Bloodfury^Xarantaur^Xarantaur
column3: the Witness^^^Speak with Xarantaur at Camp Tunka'lo.^It seems we're not the only visitors to this area. A courier relayed a message from a tauren named Xarantaur
column4: who said he was visiting a taunka village called Camp Tunka'lo. The note was somewhat cryptic
column5: but it seems this Xarantaur has come to Storm Peaks to learn the history of a taunka legend. Meet up with him
column6: <name>. See if what he knows can help us in any way. From his description
column7: Camp Tunka'lo is far to the east
column8: beyond the Terrace of the Makers and north of Dun Niffelem.

column1: Trial of the Naaru: Magtheridon^70^All^Magtheridon's Lair^A'dal^A'dal^^Trial of the Naaru: Mercy
column2: Trial of the Naaru: Strength
column3: Trial of the Naaru: Tenacity^^A'dal in Shattrath City wants you to slay Magtheridon.^Four trials you must pass before you are deemed worthy by the naaru. Only one obstacle remains
column4: mortal. Gather an army and travel to the lair of Magtheridon
column5: deep inside Hellfire Citadel. Battle your way to the heart of the chamber and destroy the foul corrupter!

column1: The Cudgel of Kar'desh^70^All^The Slave Pens^Skar'this the Heretic^Skar'this the Heretic^^^^Skar'this the Heretic in the heroic Slave Pens of Coilfang Reservoir wants you to bring him the Earthen Signet and the Blazing Signet.^Bring me the elemental signets that the cudgel requires! The earthen signet is held by Gruul the Dragonkiller. Gruul can be found inside his lair in the Blade's Edge Mountains. The second signet is the blazing heart of a creature known as Nightbane. This mythical beast is said to reside in the hallowed halls of the prophet
column2: Medivh. Make haste!

column1: The Vials of Eternity^70^All^Caverns of Time^Soridormi^Soridormi^^^^Soridormi at Caverns of Time wants you to retrieve Vashj's Vial Remnant from Lady Vashj at Coilfang Reservoir and Kael's Vial Remnant from Kael'thas Sunstrider at Tempest Keep.^Seven vials were drawn from the Well of Eternity by Illidan. He poured three into the lake on top of Mount Hyjal and a second Well of Eternity was created. For years the rest were believed lost. With the opening of the Dark Portal
column2: we've come to know that he gave one each to his lieutenants Kael'thas and Vashj. Retrieve what remains of them; we will need them as foci to open a gateway to any events tied to Mount Hyjal
column3: recent or ancient. The outcome of the Battle of Mount Hyjal must be preserved.

column1: Let's Get Out of Here!^80^Horde^Icecrown^Father Kamaros^Brother Keltan^^Killing Two Scourge With One Skeleton^^Escort Father Kamaros to safety and then report to Brother Keltan aboard Orgrim's Hammer.^The Light smiles upon me. I have not yet died in this living nightmare
column2: but the Scourge will kill me and tear my body apart for use in their 'work' here if I cannot escape. I cannot make it on my own
column3: <class>
column4: but with your help
column5: I may yet live to fight the Scourge again. Will you help me make my escape before the Scourge's butchers come to finish me off?

column1: Let's Get Out of Here^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Father Kamaros^Absalan the Pious^^Killing Two Scourge With One Skeleton^^Escort Father Kamaros to safety and then report to Absalan the Pious aboard the Skybreaker.^The Light smiles upon me. I have not yet died in this living nightmare
column2: but the Scourge will kill me and tear my body apart for use in their 'work' here if I cannot escape. I cannot make it on my own
column3: my child
column4: but with your help
column5: I may yet live to fight the Scourge again. Will you help me make my escape before the Scourge's butchers come to finish me off?

column1: Southern Sabotage^80^All^Wintergrasp^Tactical Officer Ahbramis^Tactical Officer Ahbramis^^^^Destroy Shadowsight Tower
column2: Flamewatch Tower or Winter's Edge Tower and return to Tactical Officer Ahbramis in Wintergrasp.^The three towers south of the Wintergrasp river are draining power from the Fortress! Destroy Shadowsight Tower
column3: Flamewatch Tower or Winter's Edge Tower
column4: then return to me. Remember
column5: only siege vehicles can damage a tower
column6: so make sure to protect them from the Horde!

column1: Toppling the Towers^80^All^Wintergrasp^Tactical Officer Kilrath^Tactical Officer Kilrath^^^^Destroy Shadowsight Tower
column2: Flamewatch Tower
column3: or Winter's Edge Tower and return to Tactical Officer Kilrath in Wintergrasp.^While the Alliance may be pounding on our doors
column4: a true tactician looks beyond the obvious. "Attack him where he is unprepared
column5: appear where you are not expected." <name>
column6: I need you to travel across the Wintergrasp River and destroy one of the three towers to the south. Our Warlocks report that the towers are draining power we could use to bolster our own troops. Return to me once you've destroyed a tower.

column1: Tails Up^77^All^Zul'Drak^Chronicler To'kini^Chronicler To'kini^^Relics of the Snow Leopard Goddess^^Chronicler To'kini at Zim'Torga wants you to use To'kini's Blowgun on Frost Leopards and Icepaw Bears. Return to him with 3 females of each.^Along with the Drakkari artifacts
column2: I'm interested in returning to Zandalar with some of the Zul'Drak wildlife. I have males of both the frost leopards and icepaw bears
column3: but I need females! Too bad that my trapper was killed in a most unfortunate accident. Perhaps you would be willing to fill in for him? Put the leopards and bears to sleep with this blowgun then lift their tails and return with some females if you would be so kind. They can be found near the Altars of Rhunok
column4: Quetz'lun
column5: and Har'koa.

column1: Eggs for Dubra'Jin^77^All^Zul'Drak^Ha'wana^Ha'wana^^^^Ha'wana at Dubra'Jin needs you to collect 12 Gundrak Raptor Eggs.^How ya doin'
column2: mon? Thinkin' ya might be helpin' me out? Bah'Kini be needin' lots o' the raptor eggs to be sacrificin' to Dubra'Jin. How ya thinkin' we not be overrun yet by the Drakkari? Dubra'Jin be lendin' us his aid! We need ya to gather up the raptor eggs from around the trees outside here in Gundrak. Sometimes the raptors carry 'em to keep 'em warm
column3: too.

column1: A Valiant's Field Training^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Sir Marcus Barlowe^Sir Marcus Barlowe^^^^Sir Marcus Barlowe at the Argent Tournament Grounds wants you to kill 10 Converted Heroes.^The tournament is a time for testing your skills against your peers
column2: but we must not forget that the real enemy
column3: the Scourge
column4: will not wait. As you hone your skills against others
column5: so should you maintain your edge in combat against the enemy. Travel to the area southwest of the Valley of Fallen Heroes and north of Corp'rethar. There
column6: the Scourge raises dead heroes and turns them against us. Defeat these minions of the Scourge
column7: do honor to our allies
column8: and keep yourself prepared for combat.

column1: Valiant Of Stormwind^80^Dwarf
column2: Night Elf
column3: ^Argent Tournament^Marshal Jacob Alerius^Marshal Jacob Alerius^Valiant Of Stormwind^^The Valiant's Charge^Speak with Marshal Jacob Alerius again if you wish to become a valiant of Stormwind.^Welcome
column4: champion. Word of your combat prowess has already reached my ears. Do you seek to join Stormwind's tournament delegation? You will train and rise through the ranks as you have before
column5: but when you are named a champion of Stormwind
column6: your squire will have the option of carrying our banner into battle.

column1: A Worthy Weapon^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Marshal Jacob Alerius^Marshal Jacob Alerius^^^^Bring the Blade of Drak'Mar to Marshal Jacob Alerius at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^Of all the times to have such rotten luck! My tournament blade has gone missing and I need it for a match this afternoon. One of the bards tells me that travelers used to present winter hyacinths to a lonely maiden in return for gifts. Those hyacinths grow only on the ice flowing from the Ironwall Dam
column2: on Crystalsong Forest's northwestern border with Icecrown. Gather the flowers and take them to Drak'Mar lake in northeastern Dragonblight
column3: near its border with Zul'Drak and Grizzly Hills.

column1: A Blade Fit For A Champion^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Marshal Jacob Alerius^Marshal Jacob Alerius^^^^Retrieve the Ashwood Brand and bring it to Marshal Jacob Alerius at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^Good
column2: honest
column3: honed steel may not carry the day. The other combatants are using enchanted blades and I find myself at a disadvantage
column4: but all is not lost. There's an old legend from Grizzly Hills about a maiden cursed with a frog's form to protect the blade she has long guarded. She lives among the lake frogs on the shore of Ashwood Lake
column5: just east of Ashwood Post. The only thing said to break the curse is a kiss
column6: freely given. Apply this balm before kissing anything
column7: <name>. Otherwise
column8: you'll catch warts.

column1: Archivum Data Disc^80^All^Ulduar^Archivum Data Disc^Archivum Console^^^The Celestial Planetarium^Bring the Archivum Data Disc to the Archivum Console in Ulduar.^This platinum disc is surprisingly symmetrical and devoid of any scratches or imperfections. Engraved along its edge
column2: bold runes spell out the word "ARCHIVUM." There must be a device inside Ulduar capable of reading the disc.

column1: Freya's Sigil^80^All^Ulduar^Prospector Doren^Prospector Doren^^The Celestial Planetarium^Algalon^Prospector Doren at the Archivum in Ulduar wants you to obtain Freya's Sigil.^Freya's Sigil is going to be one of the tougher ones
column2: I reckon. According to the Archivum
column3: the essence of the Sigil is tied to her three elder servants
column4: Brightleaf
column5: Ironbranch and Stonebark. Should any of the elders be harmed
column6: the Sigil's integrity will be compromised. Sparing the elders
column7: however
column8: means that Freya will be more powerful when you face her. What can I say
column9: <name>. We're stuck between a rock and hard place.

column1: The Celestial Planetarium^80^All^Ulduar^Prospector Doren^Prospector Doren^^Archivum Data Disc^Freya's Sigil
column2: Hodir's Sigil
column3: Thorim's Sigil
column4: Mimiron's Sigil^Prospector Doren at the Archivum in Ulduar wants you to locate the entrance to the Celestial Planetarium.^Listen
column5: <lad/lass>! Azeroth's fate is at stake here. Our only chance is to get to the Celestial Planetarium in time to find this Algalon and stop him from beaming back any messages to his Titan masters. Locate the Celestial Planetarium and come back with any information you get. We might still have some time to prepare for Algalon's arrival.

column1: Hodir's Sigil^80^All^Ulduar^Prospector Doren^Prospector Doren^^The Celestial Planetarium^Algalon^Prospector Doren at the Archivum in Ulduar wants you to obtain Hodir's Sigil.^Hodir's Sigil won't be easy to obtain. Not only are ye going to have to defeat Hodir himself
column2: but yer going to have to do it before he destroys the chest that contains it! Check the Archivum console if you need more information. That thing contains more knowledge than all of the world's libraries put together!

column1: Thorim's Sigil^80^All^Ulduar^Prospector Doren^Prospector Doren^^The Celestial Planetarium^Algalon^Prospector Doren at the Archivum in Ulduar wants you to obtain Thorim's Sigil.^Thorim's not himself
column2: <name>. He's come under a dark influence. An evil presence under the guise of an illusion pretends to be his lost wife
column3: Sif. Ye can't let him be overcome by this impostor's spell. If he does
column4: the location of his sigil might forever be lost! Yer going to have to beat some sense into him and yer going to have to do it quick. As always
column5: the Archivum Console will give ye all the gory details... even the ones ye don't like.

column1: Mimiron's Sigil^80^All^Ulduar^Prospector Doren^Prospector Doren^^The Celestial Planetarium^Algalon^Prospector Doren at the Ulduar Archivum wants you to obtain Mimiron's Sigil.^Mimiron's a clever one. His entire abode is rigged with some sort of self-destruction mechanism. Unfortunately yer gonna have to race against it if ye want to get his sigil. Check the Archivum Console for more details if ye need them.
Algalon^80^All^Ulduar^Prospector Doren^Archivum Console^^Freya's Sigil
column2: Hodir's Sigil
column3: Thorim's Sigil
column4: Mimiron's Sigil^All Is Well That Ends Well^Bring the Sigils of the Watchers to the Archivum Console in Ulduar.^You really did it
column5: <name>. Take the sigils to the Archivum Console and see if you can gain access to the Celestial Planetarium. You best hurry
column6: <lad/lass>. Time is of the essence.

column1: The Edge Of Winter^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Marshal Jacob Alerius^Marshal Jacob Alerius^^^^Marshal Jacob Alerius at the Argent Tournament Grounds wants you to bring him Winter's Edge.^Curse that death knight for breaking my sword! In southern Crystalsong Forest
column2: overlooking the Crystal Vice's exit
column3: you will find Lord Everblaze. Kill him and take the everburning ember from his corpse. Bring it to the center of Winter's Breath Lake in northern Howling Fjord
column4: and use it to free the maiden encased in ice. She is the guardian of an ancient sword and will award it to whoever frees her. Prove your worth and earn the weapon that she has guarded for so long
column5: <name>.

column1: Learning The Reins^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Scout Shalyndria^Scout Shalyndria^^^^Strike a Melee Target with Thrust 5 times
column2: use Shield-Breaker on 2 vulnerable Ranged Targets
column3: use Charge on 2 vulnerable Charge Targets and then return to Scout Shalyndria at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^Most of the tournament's competitions require competitors to master the command of a mount in battle. In order to familiarize you with mounted combat
column4: we've put up training dummies all over the northern part of the tournament grounds. Visit the stables outside the pavilion
column5: equip your lance
column6: and mount up on the Quel'dorei steed. Familiarize yourself with the tactics available to you and use them to defeat the three different kinds of training dummies.

column1: Val'anyr
column2: Hammer of Ancient Kings^80^All^Ulduar^Archivum Console^Archivum Console^Ancient History^^^Throw the Shattered Pieces of Val'anyr into Yogg-Saron's maw while he's casting Deafening Roar and defeat Yogg-Saron and recover the Reforged Hammer of Ancient Kings.^The Archivum Console has hinted at a possible way to rebind the fragments of Val'anyr: you must get the fragments inside the physical form of the being known as Yogg-Saron. It sounds like a long shot
column3: but for an artifact of such power you think the risk might just be worth it.

column1: All Is Well That Ends Well^80^All^Ulduar^Reply-Code Alpha^Rhonin^^Algalon^^Take the Reply-Code Alpha to Rhonin in Dalaran.^We'd best hurry now
column2: <name>. We're going to have to transmit the reply-code from Dalaran. Take it to Rhonin
column3: I will meet you there.

column1: The Black Knight of Westfall?^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Crusader Rhydalla^Crusader Rhydalla^The Black Knight of Westfall?^^The Seer's Crystal^Investigate the Black Knight's claims and return to Crusader Rhydalla at the Argent Tournament Grounds with your findings.^No doubt you've heard the disturbing rumors about the contestant the others are calling the Black Knight. It's said that any rider who was scheduled to face him in combat has met an untimely end. Of course
column2: we have no definitive proof of anything
column3: but it wouldn't hurt to look into this knight's background. He claims to be descended from the Cooper family of Westfall. Would you visit their residence in the western part of Moonbrook in Westfall? See if you can find any proof of his story.

column1: The Black Knight of Silverpine?^80^Horde^Argent Tournament^Crusader Rhydalla^Crusader Rhydalla^The Black Knight of Silverpine?^^The Seer's Crystal^Investigate the Black Knight's claims and return to Crusader Rhydalla at the Argent Tournament Grounds with your findings.^No doubt you've heard the disturbing rumors about the contestant the others are calling the Black Knight. It's said that any rider who was scheduled to face him in combat has met an untimely end. Of course
column2: we have no definitive proof of anything
column3: but it wouldn't hurt to look into this knight's background. He claims to hail from Valgan's Field in Silverpine Forest. It's a small farm on the western shore of Lordamere Lake. Would you visit the farm and let me know if there's any truth to his story?

column1: The Seer's Crystal^80^All^Argent Tournament^Crusader Rhydalla^Crusader Rhydalla^The Black Knight of Westfall?^^The Stories Dead Men Tell^Bring a Seer's Crystal to Crusader Rhydalla at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^Now that we know there's no truth to the Black Knight's stories
column2: we must find a way to connect him to the murdered knights. I know a way to reveal the truth about how they died
column3: but it requires a rare material. We must gain a seer's crystal
column4: found only among the unbound seers who congregate near night elf ruins in the Forlorn Woods in the central part of Crystalsong Forest. Find one of these seers
column5: <name>
column6: and bring me the crystal it holds.

column1: The Stories Dead Men Tell^80^All^Argent Tournament^Crusader Rhydalla^Crusader Rhydalla^The Stories Dead Men Tell^The Seer's Crystal^^Use the Seer's Crystal at the graves of Sir Wendell Balfour
column2: Lorien Sunblaze
column3: and Conall Irongrip to determine how they died
column4: then return to Crusader Rhydalla.^The crystal will reveal the truth about how three of the tournament's combatants died. Take it with you to the graveyard east of the Tournament Grounds and use it before the graves of Sir Wendell Balfour
column5: Lorien Sunblaze
column6: and Conall Irongrip. If indeed these men were murdered
column7: then we must find a way to tie it to the Black Knight before he strikes again. Look closely at what the crystal tells you
column8: <name>
column9: for we must be certain these deaths were not accidental.

column1: There's Something About the Squire^80^All^Argent Tournament^Crusader Rhydalla^Crusader Rhydalla^The Stories Dead Men Tell^^^Obtain a Large Femur from a Skeletal Woodcutter and use it to incapacitate Maloric. Search Maloric for evidence
column2: then report back to Crusader Rhydalla at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^Every day
column3: the Black Knight's squire
column4: Maloric
column5: makes a big show of heading to Crystalsong Forest with his axe over his shoulder. He wants us to believe he's chopping wood
column6: but he never returns with more than a few twigs. He usually goes toward the ruins southwest of the Mirror of Twilight. He spends a lot of time out there
column7: even for a squire with responsibilities to his knight. Find a way to distract or incapacitate him and search him. If he's up to something
column8: we'll know it.

column1: The Black Knight's Orders^80^All^Argent Tournament^Crusader Rhydalla^Crusader Rhydalla^The Stories Dead Men Tell^^^Use the Enchanted Bridle to gain control of the Black Knight's Gryphon and ride it to its destination. Once you have arrived
column2: recover the Stolen Tournament Invitation and the Black Knight's Orders and bring them to Crusader Rhydalla at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^We must discover who sent the Black Knight to the tournament and what his master hopes to gain by killing the competitors. The Kirin Tor has offered to help in this matter and provided us with something to help our search. Take this enchanted bridle to the Black Knight's camp on the eastern edge of the tournament grounds and use it to gain control over the Black Knight's gryphon. The bridle's magic will force the gryphon to take you to his master's home. Search it and return with anything you find.

column1: The Black Knight's Fall^80^All^Argent Tournament^Crusader Rhydalla^Crusader Rhydalla^^^The Black Knight's Curse^Defeat the Black Knight and then speak to Crusader Rhydalla at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^We must put an end to the Black Knight's scheming
column2: and show those who oppose us that we will not stand by and allow our champions to be murdered. By now
column3: he will suspect that someone is on his trail. Challenge him in the light of day

column1: The Grand Melee^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Captain Joseph Holley^Captain Joseph Holley^^^^Bring 3 Marks of the Valiant to Captain Joseph Holley at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^The grand melee is the most important of the tournament's competitions. The people of Stormwind adore their knights and are looking forward to seeing us win the melee. To that end
column2: they've been honing their skills against the other valiants. I suggest you do the same. Go to the stables outside the pavilion

column4: mount the stabled Elwynn steed
column5: and challenge the valiants. They wait in the Alliance Valiants' Ring just outside our tent.

column1: A Blade Fit For A Champion^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Arcanist Taelis^Arcanist Taelis^^^^Retrieve the Ashwood Brand and bring it to Arcanist Taelis at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^Some of the champions believe an ancient weapon born of Northrend will bring them luck in the tourney. I have agreed to help them search for these weapons. There's an old legend from Grizzly Hills about a maiden cursed with a frog's form to protect the blade she has long guarded. She lives among the lake frogs on the shore of Ashwood Lake
column2: just east of Ashwood Post. The only thing said to break the curse is a kiss
column3: freely given. Apply this balm before kissing anything
column4: <name>. Otherwise
column5: you'll catch warts.

column1: The Argent Tournament^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Justicar Mariel Trueheart^Arcanist Taelis^The Argent Tournament^^Mastery Of The Shield-Breaker
column2: Mastery Of The Charge^Speak with Arcanist Taelis at the Argent Tournament grounds to enroll in the tournament.^We have invited you here to test your skill and valor against others who have bravely opposed the Scourge. Many have been our divisions
column3: but the time has come for heroes fighting under all banners to test their blades against one another in preparation for facing our mutual enemy. Arcanist Taelis is the Silver Covenant's representative to the tournament and he'll enter your name into the rolls and begin your training. Seek him out inside the large Alliance tent in the northeastern part of the grounds.

column1: A Worthy Weapon^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Arcanist Taelis^Arcanist Taelis^^^^Bring the Blade of Drak'Mar to Arcanist Taelis at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^Our champions have taken a liking to ancient weapons produced here in Northrend. I've heard the bards telling tales of travelers offering winter hyacinths to a lonely maiden in return for gifts. Those hyacinths grow only on the ice flowing from the Ironwall Dam
column2: on Crystalsong Forest's northwestern border with Icecrown. Gather the flowers and take them to the circle of lamps in Drak'Mar Lake in northeastern Dragonblight
column3: near Zul'Drak and Grizzly Hills. Ask the lonely maiden for a worthy blade.

column1: A Blade Fit For A Champion^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Lana Stouthammer^Lana Stouthammer^^^^Retrieve the Ashwood Brand and bring it to Lana Stouthammer at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^Good
column2: honest
column3: honed steel may not carry the day. The other combatants are using enchanted blades and I find myself at a disadvantage
column4: but all is not lost. There's an old legend from Grizzly Hills about a maiden cursed with a frog's form to protect the blade she has long guarded. She lives among the lake frogs on the shore of Ashwood Lake
column5: just east of Ashwood Post. The only thing said to break the curse is a kiss
column6: freely given. Apply this balm before kissing anything
column7: <name>. Otherwise
column8: you'll catch warts.

column1: A Worthy Weapon^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Lana Stouthammer^Lana Stouthammer^^^^Bring the Blade of Drak'Mar to Lana Stouthammer at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^Of all the times to have such rotten luck! My tournament blade has gone missing and I need it for a match this afternoon. One of the bards tells me that travelers used to present winter hyacinths to a lonely maiden in return for gifts. Those hyacinths grow only on the ice flowing from the Ironwall Dam
column2: on Crystalsong Forest's northwestern border with Icecrown. Gather the flowers and take them to Drak'Mar lake in northeastern Dragonblight
column3: near its border with Zul'Drak and Grizzly Hills.

column1: The Edge Of Winter^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Lana Stouthammer^Lana Stouthammer^^Alliance Tournament Eligibility Marker^^Lana Stouthammer at the Argent Tournament Grounds wants you to bring her Winter's Edge.^Curse that death knight for breaking my sword! In southern Crystalsong Forest
column2: overlooking the Crystal Vice's exit
column3: you will find Lord Everblaze. Kill him and take the everburning ember from his corpse. Bring it to the center of Winter's Breath Lake in northern Howling Fjord
column4: and use it to free the maiden encased in ice. She is the guardian of an ancient sword and will award it to whoever frees her. Prove your worth and earn the weapon that she has guarded for so long
column5: <name>.

column1: A Valiant's Field Training^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Rollo Sureshot^Rollo Sureshot^^^^Rollo Sureshot at the Argent Tournament Grounds wants you to kill 10 Converted Heroes.^The tournament is a time for testing your skills against your peers
column2: but we must not forget that the real enemy
column3: the Scourge
column4: will not wait. As you hone your skills against others
column5: so should you maintain your edge in combat against the enemy. Travel to the area southwest of the Valley of Fallen Heroes and north of Corp'rethar. There
column6: the Scourge raises dead heroes and turns them against us. Defeat these minions of the Scourge
column7: do honor to our allies
column8: and keep yourself prepared for combat.

column1: Threat From Above^80^Alliance^Death Knight^Crok Scourgebane^Crok Scourgebane^^^^Crok Scourgebane at the Argent Tournament wants you to defeat Chillmaw and 3 Cultist Bombardiers.^The Argent Crusade has doubled the guard since your exposure of the Cult of the Damned's infiltrator. The scouts reporting seeing Chillmaw to the southwest
column2: flying over the area between the Ironwall Rampart and Aldur'thar.

column1: Taking Battle To The Enemy^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Cellian Daybreak^Cellian Daybreak^^Eadric the Pure^^Cellian Daybreak at the Argent Tournament Grounds wants you to kill 15 members of the Cult of the Damned. You may kill Cult of the Damned members in any part of Icecrown.^The coliseum is perched in the most dangerous part of the world
column2: <name>. The territory we've taken from the Scourge has been paid for in blood and misery
column3: yet the enemy continues to strike back with a seemingly limitless army. To make matters worse
column4: this undead army is supported and assisted by mortal sympathizers
column5: the Cult of the Damned. Go forth into Icecrown and slay any cultists you encounter.

column1: Among the Champions^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Luuri^Luuri^^Eadric the Pure^^Bring 4 Marks of the Champion to Luuri at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^As a champion
column2: you have mastered the art of mounted combat
column3: besting challengers of all levels. When the tournament begins
column4: those you have defeated will have redoubled their efforts and will seek to avenge their losses to you. It would be wise to continue practicing your skills against the combatants waiting in the Ring of Champions. Equip your lance
column5: go to the stables on the southern side of the grounds. then mount up on any mount you're permitted to use
column6: and face the champions.

column1: Taking Battle To The Enemy^80^Alliance^Death Knight^Zor'be the Bloodletter^Zor'be the Bloodletter^^The Scourgebane^^Zor'be the Bloodletter at the Argent Tournament Grounds wants you to kill 15 members of the Cult of the Damned. You may kill cultists in any part of Icecrown.^While we all play at mock combat
column2: it will do us good to remember that the real enemy surrounds us. The Argent Crusade wants to use competition to find the best fighters
column3: but we can tell that by who returns from battle. Let's show the paladins that we are willing to take battle to the Cult of the Damned
column4: even while making preparations for the tournament. Go forth into Icecrown and slay any of the cultists you encounter. They have a strong presence around Aldur'thar and Deathspeaker's Watch.

column1: Among the Champions^80^Alliance^Death Knight^Illyrie Nightfall^Illyrie Nightfall^^The Scourgebane^^Bring 4 Marks of the Champion to Illyrie Nightfall at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^As a champion
column2: you have mastered the art of mounted combat
column3: overcoming challengers of all levels. You must make certain that you can defeat anyone you face when the tournament begins. You should continue honing your own skills and learning more about the weaknesses of your opponents. Champions representing all cities practice in the Ring of Champions near the stables. Go to the stables
column4: equip your lance
column5: and pick any mount you're permitted to ride
column6: then face the champions.
