column1: Heroic: The Celestial Planetarium^80^All^Ulduar^Prospector Loren^Prospector Loren^^Heroic: Archivum Data Disc^Heroic: Freya's Sigil
column2: Heroic: Hodir's Sigil
column3: Heroic: Thorim's Sigil
column4: Heroic: Mimiron's Sigil^Prospector Loren at the Archivum in Ulduar wants you to locate the entrance to the Celestial Planetarium.^Listen
column5: <lad/lass>! Azeroth's fate is at stake here. Our only chance is to get to the Celestial Planetarium in time to find this Algalon and stop him from beaming back any messages to his Titan masters. Locate the Celestial Planetarium and come back with any information you get. We might still have some time to prepare for Algalon's arrival.

column1: Heroic: Archivum Data Disc^80^All^Ulduar^Archivum Data Disc^Archivum Console^^^Heroic: The Celestial Planetarium^Bring the Archivum Data Disc to the Archivum Console in Ulduar.^This platinum disc is surprisingly symmetrical and devoid of any scratches or imperfections. Engraved along its edge
column2: bold runes spell out the word "ARCHIVUM." There must be a device inside Ulduar capable of reading the disc.

column1: Heroic: Algalon^80^All^Ulduar^Prospector Loren^Archivum Console^^Heroic: Freya's Sigil
column2: Heroic: Hodir's Sigil
column3: Heroic: Thorim's Sigil
column4: Heroic: Mimiron's Sigil^Heroic: All Is Well That Ends Well^Bring the Sigils of the Watchers to the Archivum Console in Ulduar.^You really did it
column5: <name>. Take the sigils to the Archivum Console and see if you can gain access to the Celestial Planetarium. You best hurry
column6: <lad/lass>. Time is of the essence.

column1: Heroic: All Is Well That Ends Well^80^All^Ulduar^Reply-Code Alpha^Rhonin^^Heroic: Algalon^^Take the Reply-Code Alpha to Rhonin in Dalaran.^We'd best hurry now
column2: <name>. We're going to have to transmit the reply-code from Dalaran. Take it to Rhonin
column3: I will meet you there.

column1: Heroic: Freya's Sigil^80^All^Ulduar^Prospector Loren^Prospector Loren^^Heroic: The Celestial Planetarium^Heroic: Algalon^Prospector Loren at the Archivum in Ulduar wants you to obtain Freya's Sigil.^Freya's Sigil is going to be one of the tougher ones
column2: I reckon. According to the Archivum
column3: the essence of the Sigil is tied to her three elder servants
column4: Brightleaf
column5: Ironbranch and Stonebark. Should any of the elders be harmed
column6: the Sigil's integrity will be compromised. Sparing the elders
column7: however
column8: means that Freya will be more powerful when you face her. What can I say
column9: <name>. We're stuck between a rock and hard place.

column1: Heroic: Hodir's Sigil^80^All^Ulduar^Prospector Loren^Prospector Loren^^Heroic: The Celestial Planetarium^Heroic: Algalon^Prospector Loren at the Archivum in Ulduar wants you to obtain Hodir's Sigil.^Hodir's Sigil won't be easy to obtain. Not only are ye going to have to defeat Hodir himself
column2: but yer going to have to do it before he destroys the chest that contains it! Check the Archivum console if you need more information. That thing contains more knowledge than all of the world's libraries put together!

column1: Heroic: Thorim's Sigil^80^All^Ulduar^Prospector Loren^Prospector Loren^^Heroic: The Celestial Planetarium^Heroic: Algalon^Prospector Loren at the Archivum in Ulduar wants you to obtain Thorim's Sigil.^Thorim's not himself
column2: <name>. He's come under a dark influence. An evil presence under the guise of an illusion pretends to be his lost wife
column3: Sif. Ye can't let him be overcome by this impostor's spell. If he does
column4: the location of his sigil might forever be lost! Yer going to have to beat some sense into him and yer going to have to do it quick. As always
column5: the Archivum Console will give ye all the gory details... even the ones ye don't like.

column1: Heroic: Mimiron's Sigil^80^All^Ulduar^Prospector Loren^Prospector Loren^^Heroic: The Celestial Planetarium^Heroic: Algalon^Prospector Loren at the Ulduar Archivum wants you to obtain Mimiron's Sigil.^Mimiron's a clever one. His entire abode is rigged with some sort of self-destruction mechanism. Unfortunately yer gonna have to race against it if ye want to get his sigil. Check the Archivum Console for more details if ye need them.
Mastery Of Melee^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Arcanist Taelis^Arcanist Taelis^The Argent Tournament^^Up To The Challenge^Equip your lance
column2: then mount the Stabled Quel'dorei Steed outside the pavilion. Speak to Jeran Lockwood and use Thrust 5 times on a Melee Target
column3: then return to Arcanist Taelis at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^The heart of tournament competition is mounted melee combat. Take this lance and mount the stabled Quel'dorei steed just outside the pavilion. Once you're mounted
column4: seek out Jeran Lockwood. He's on the northern edge of the tournament grounds at the training area east of the Aspirants' Ring. Jeran will instruct you on how to use your defenses to keep you safe while attacking a melee target at close range.

column1: Mastery Of Melee^80^Horde^Argent Tournament^Magister Edien Sunhollow^Magister Edien Sunhollow^The Argent Tournament^^Up To The Challenge^Equip your lance
column2: then mount the Stabled Sunreaver Hawkstrider outside the pavilion. Speak to Jeran Lockwood and use Thrust 5 times on a Melee Target
column3: then return to Magister Edien Sunhollow at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^The heart of tournament competition is mounted melee combat. Take this lance and mount the stabled Sunreaver hawkstrider just outside the pavilion. Once you're mounted
column4: seek out Jeran Lockwood. He's on the northern edge of the tournament grounds at the training area east of the Aspirants' Ring. Jeran will instruct you on how to use your defenses to keep you safe while attacking a melee target at close range.

column1: The Ghostfish^70^All^Fishing^Marcia Chase^Marcia Chase^^^^Marcia Chase in Dalaran City wants you to discover the mystery of the Phantom Ghostfish.^Any Northrend angler worth <his/her> salt knows about the pygmy suckerfish. It's not edible
column2: but sometimes useful to alchemists. There is
column3: however
column4: a stealthy fish that hides among the suckerfish in the River's Heart of Sholazar Basin. The phantom ghostfish. When out of water
column5: they become increasingly translucent until they fade away completely. Some hypothesize they return to Sholazar
column6: and others are more... superstitious. I want you to catch this fish and discover its secret by any means!

column1: Jewel Of The Sewers^70^All^Fishing^Marcia Chase^Marcia Chase^^^^Marcia Chase in Dalaran City wants you to bring her a piece of Corroded Jewelry.^Hard to believe that most people fish in the Dalaran Sewers for giant rats and mutated fish. Especially when those waters are filled with priceless jewelry - discarded by broken hearted fools
column2: thieves
column3: and careless drunks. The trick is to let your hook drag the bottom and don't pull up too hard when you get something. Try it out
column4: <name>. I'd be willing to trade whatever you find for a few trinkets of my own.

column1: Blood Is Thicker^70^All^Fishing^Marcia Chase^Marcia Chase^^^^Marcia Chase in Dalaran City wants you to bring her 5 Bloodtooth Frenzies.^The bloodtooth is a feisty little fish used in a recipe to cure infected wounds. We could use some of them
column2: if you're up to it. As the name suggests
column3: they've a hunger for blood. The only way I know how to catch the little devils is by creating a blood pool and fishing in it. Get yourself covered in blood - just slaughter a beast in the Borean Tundra - and then jump in the water. It'll wash right off and create the perfect fishing spot.

column1: Dangerously Delicious^70^All^Fishing^Marcia Chase^Marcia Chase^^^^Marcia Chase in Dalaran City wants you to bring her 10 Terrorfish.^The best fishing is often the most dangerous. Wintergrasp boasts a bountiful catch for the brazen. In fact
column2: it's the only place to catch the fabled Terrorfish - a fish both lethal and delicious. Bring me some
column3: and we'll have something to discuss.

column1: Mastery Of The Shield-Breaker^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Scout Shalyndria^Scout Shalyndria^^The Argent Tournament^Up To The Challenge^Equip your lance and mount the Stabled Quel'dorei Steed outside the pavilion. Speak to Valis Windchaser and use Shield-Breaker on 2 vulnerable Ranged Targets
column2: then return to Scout Shalyndria at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^You'll need to learn how to break through an opponent's defenses to succeed in mounted combat. Take this lance and mount the stabled Quel'dorei steed just outside the pavilion. Once you're mounted
column3: seek out Valis Windchaser. He'll be on the northern edge of the tournament grounds at the training area east of the Aspirants' Ring. Valis will teach you the basics of using a ranged shield breaker attack to make a ranged target vulnerable.

column1: Disarmed!^70^All^Fishing^Marcia Chase^Olisarra the Kind^^^^Olisarra the Kind in Dalaran City wants you to return the Severed Arm to her.^I've received word of an unfortunate accident at the Dalaran prison; a guard had his arm severed and thrown into the water by a particularly vicious inmate. Our first aid clinic promises they can reattach the arm if we bring it back. You fish long enough in the water outside the prison
column2: and I'd bet my favorite fishing pole that arm will surface. Find that arm
column3: and bring it to Olisarra the Kind here in Dalaran. She'll know what to do.

column1: Mastery Of The Charge^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Avareth Swiftstrike^Avareth Swiftstrike^^The Argent Tournament^Up To The Challenge^Equip your lance and mount the Stabled Quel'dorei Steed outside the pavilion. Speak to Rugan Steelbelly and Charge 2 vulnerable Charge Targets
column2: then return to Avareth Swiftstrike at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^Your strongest attack in mounted combat is undoubtedly the charge. Take this lance and mount the stabled Quel'dorei steed just outside the pavilion. Once you're mounted
column3: speak with Rugan Steelbelly. He's on the northern edge of the tournament grounds at the training area east of the Aspirants' Ring. Rugan will tell you how to use this powerful ability and teach you some basic strategies.

column2: then return to Amariel Sunsworn at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^Your strongest attack in mounted combat is undoubtedly the charge. Take this lance and mount the stabled Sunreaver hawkstrider just outside the pavilion. Once you're mounted

column1: Sealed Vial of Poison^80^All^Dalaran^Sealed Vial of Poison^Alchemist Cinesra^^^^Bring the Seal Vial of Poison to Alchemist Cinesra in the Dalaran Sewers.^This vial of poison looks particularly dangerous. Perhaps someone in Dalaran might be interested in it.

Contributin' To The Cause^80^All^Argent Tournament^Squire Artie^Squire Artie^^^^Speak with Squire Artie to contribute 10 gold to the Argent Crusade's cause.^The bestest of the champions come to the chapel to hear the argent confessor speak every day. You should see how much she inspires them
column2: <name>. Not only do they fight for the Argent Crusade
column3: but they put a lot of money into the collection basket when I take it around. Maybe you'd like to contribute too?

column1: At The Enemy's Gates^80^Alliance^Argent Tournament^Captain Joseph Holley^Captain Joseph Holley^^^^Captain Joseph Holley at the Argent Tournament Grounds wants you to kill 15 Boneguard Footmen
column2: 10 Boneguard Scouts
column3: and 3 Boneguard Lieutenants.^Even as we ready for the tournament
column4: Argent Crusade forces prepare the way for an assault on the enemy's stronghold of Icecrown Citadel. In the Court of Bones in southwestern Icecrown
column5: a few brave crusaders have set up a forward camp on the southern side of Corp'rethar. Equip your lance and mount the stabled campaign charger at the camp
column6: then destroy the Lich King's minions. Do not fear the masses of boneguard footmen
column7: <name>
column8: for they can easily be trampled under your horse's hooves.

column1: Toxic Tolerance^53^Horde^Un'Goro Crater^Mor'vek^Mor'vek^Toxic Tolerance^^^Mor'vek in Un'goro Crater claims that if you were poisoned by Venomhide Ravasaur blood 20 times
column2: you could ride one without dying. Attack Venomhide Ravasaurs for a chance to be poisoned.^You want to ride a Venomhide? Then I've got bad news for you. The Venomhide Ravasaurs
column3: they're all poison: Poison blood
column4: poison spit
column5: poison skin. You climb on one
column6: you fall off dead in a few hours. You'd have to build up a resistance to their toxins before I sold you one
column7: and that takes a long
column8: LONG time... you'd need to be splashed with poisonous blood while fighting one numerous times. If you're really interested
column9: the venomhides prefer the northern area of of the Marshlands
column10: northwest of here.

column1: Venomhide Eggs^53^All^Un'Goro Crater^Mor'vek^Mor'vek^Toxic Tolerance^^^Bring 4 Venomhide Ravasaur Eggs to Mor'vek in the southeast part of the Marshlands.^Now that you've built up an immunity to venomhide toxin
column2: you can safely handle the animals and their eggs. Venomhides are vicious and must be trained from the moment they hatch. If you want to ride one
column3: you'll need an unhatched egg. Scattered throughout the Marshlands are a number of ravasaur nests. Look for the eggs with lighter colored shells -- those are the ones that will hatch venomhides. If you bring me several of the eggs
column4: I'll allow you to keep one and raise its hatchling
column5: with my guidance.

column1: Hungry
column2: Hungry Hatchling^53^Orc
column3: Blood Elf^Un'Goro Crater^Venomhide Hatchling^Venomhide Hatchling^^^^Your Venomhide Hatchling wants you to feed it 15 pieces of Fresh Dinosaur Meat.^The venomhide hatchling looks at you expectantly
column4: then begins to scrawl a pictogram into the dirt. The drawings are rough
column5: but you can make out the shapes of diemetradons
column6: stegodons
column7: and pterrordaxes. As the raptor finishes the sketch
column8: it looks up at you
column9: bares its teeth
column10: and makes a biting motion. Your venomhide hatchling must be craving fresh meat from these animals. Find and kill any type of diematradon
column11: stegodon
column12: or pterrordax in Un'Goro Crater and feed its meat to your hungry hatchling.

column1: Gorishi Grub^53^Orc
column2: Blood Elf^Un'Goro Crater^Venomhide Hatchling^Venomhide Hatchling^^^^Your Venomhide Hatchling wants you to feed it 10 Silithid Meat.^The venomhide hatchling looks at you expectantly
column3: then begins to scrawl a pictogram into the dirt. The hatchling's drawings seem to resemble various types of large insects
column4: perhaps the gorishi silithids. The hatchling finishes his picture
column5: then gestures at it with one short arm
column6: snaps its jaws
column7: and licks its lips. It must want you to go to the Slithering Scar
column8: in center of the southern part of Un'Goro Crater
column9: and gather silithid meat. When you have the meat
column10: feed it to your hungry hatchling.

column1: Poached
column2: Scrambled
column3: Or Raw?^53^Orc
column4: Blood Elf^Un'Goro Crater^Venomhide Hatchling^Venomhide Hatchling^^^^Your Venomhide Hatchling wants you to feed it 12 Silithid Eggs.^The venomhide hatchling's stomach growls as it gestures to get your attention. It begins scratching pictures of silithids into the dirt
column5: adding small ovals underneath them. It looks at you hopefully and gestures at the circles. They can only mean silithid eggs. The Noxious Lair
column6: in western Tanaris and near the border with Un'Goro Crater
column7: would probably be a great place to find the eggs your little hatchling wants.

column1: Searing Roc Feathers^53^Orc
column2: Blood Elf^Un'Goro Crater^Venomhide Hatchling^Venomhide Hatchling^^^^Your Venomhide Hatchling wants you to get 5 pieces of Searing Roc Plumage.^The hatchling looks at you for a moment
column3: almost as if wondering whether you'll understand. It scrawls a picture of a pair of feathers in the dirt
column4: then points with one claw to the bindings at its elbows and knees. It doesn't seem hungry
column5: but what could the feathers be for? It must want them for adornments like the ones you've seen on other raptors. The largest feathers come from the searing rocs that congregate around the bones of large creatures in western Tanaris
column6: northeast of Thistleshrub Valley.

column1: They Grow Up So Fast^53^All^Un'Goro Crater^Mor'vek^Mor'vek^Toxic Tolerance^^^Return 20 Venomhide Baby Teeth
column2: the Venomhide Hatchling
column3: 20 Runecloth
column4: 20 Rugged Leather
column5: and 80 gold to Mor'vek in the southeastern part of the Marshlands in Un'Goro Crater.^With your expert feeding and care
column6: your venomhide hatchling will grow quickly. As they grow
column7: their hatchling teeth will be replaced by adult teeth. If you keep the teeth shed by your hatchling as it grows
column8: you'll have an easy way to tell when it's mature enough to be trained as a mount. Your venomhide will let you know what it needs
column9: so pay close attention. When it has shed all of its baby teeth
column10: return to me with your venomhide and the materials for your saddle and I'll do the rest.

column1: An Injured Colleague^73^All^Thunder Bluff^Sorn Proudmane^Aponi Brightmane^^^^Take the Battered Tribal Shield to Aponi Brightmane on Elder Rise within Thunder Bluff.^The fight's been hard up here
column2: <class>
column3: as I'm sure you know. We're holding out
column4: but not everyone has gone unscathed. A warrior in our band
column5: Aponi Brightmane
column6: was taken ill by an infected wound in her arm. She's been taken back to Thunder Bluff for recuperation. It seems she left her shield here at the front in the confusion
column7: however - could you take it to her
column8: along with our well-wishes? Her smile is missed around here. You can find her on Elder Rise on the Bluff.

column1: The Black Knight's Curse^80^All^Argent Tournament^Crusader Rhydalla^Crusader Rhydalla^^The Black Knight's Fall^The Black Knight's Fate^Crusader Rhydalla at the Argent Tournament Grounds wants you to investigate the Black Knight's Grave.^I wanted to remove the Black Knight's remains from the tournament grounds after your victory
column2: but Confessor Paletress insisted that he receive a decent burial. Ever since
column3: a dark presence has lingered in the cemetery and people are afraid to go there to visit the fallen. Would you visit the cemetery just past the eastern end of the tournament grounds and see if you can discover what's happening?

column1: The Black Knight's Fate^80^All^Argent Tournament^Crusader Rhydalla^Crusader Rhydalla^^The Black Knight's Curse^^Capture Doctor Kolher's Orders at Deathspeaker's Watch
column2: then return to Crusader Rhydalla at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^You said the body was taken by cultists? I can only think of one place they would have gone
column3: Deathspeaker's Watch
column4: the encampment on the rise west of the tournament grounds. Whatever the cultists are doing must be stopped. The rumors I've heard can only be true
column5: then. The infamous Doctor Kohler must be among the cultists
column6: practicing his arts. Look for a rise or an altar overlooking the cultist camp
column7: slay the doctor
column8: and look for proof of his plans. Slow down his work in any other way you can.

column1: A Leg Up^80^All^Argent Tournament^Narasi Snowdawn^Narasi Snowdawn^^^^Recover 10 Stolen Tallstrider Legs for Narasi Snowdawn at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^The Argent Crusade dispatched a fast ship carrying tallstrider meat and other supplies for us here at the tournament grounds
column2: but it never arrived. Scouts reported seeing it attacked by the kvaldir
column3: fearsome vrykul raiders who roam the seas. They've slain the crew and taken the cargo to an island called Hrothgar's Landing. If you look to the north
column4: you can see it shrouded in the mist. Would you help us in recovering the stolen supplies? Without those tallstrider legs
column5: we'll soon be out of food.

column1: Breakfast Of Champions^80^All^Argent Tournament^Savinia Loresong^Savinia Loresong^^^^Acquire 4 Jormungar Egg Sacs and bring them to Savinia Loresong at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^Now that the coliseum is complete
column2: the Argent Crusade has asked us to help look after the creatures that champions will be fighting. The giant jormungar have perhaps the strangest diet; they grow strong by eating the eggs of their own kind and the best eggs come from deep jormungar. Take this drum to the Foot Steppes in central Storm Peaks and play them near the snow mounds you see there. Rouse the deep jormungar
column3: kill them
column4: and gather their egg sacs.

column1: The Light's Mercy^80^All^Argent Tournament^Narasi Snowdawn^Narasi Snowdawn^^^^Use the Confessor's Prayer Book to perform last rites for 8 Slain Tualiq Villagers and then return to Narasi Snowdawn at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^I've been listening to Confessor Paletress speak
column2: and I must tell you
column3: her words have given me much to consider. It is not enough to fight beside the crusaders; we must take up their mission. Off the north coast is Hrothgar's Landing
column4: where the seagoing Kvaldir have overrun an old tuskarr settlement and slain the villagers. Take this book and read the rites for the dead near the corpses of the villagers. It will allow their spirits to escape the mists engulfing the island and find peace.

Gormok Wants His Snobolds^80^All^Argent Tournament^Savinia Loresong^Savinia Loresong^^^^Use the Weighted Net to capture 8 Snowblind Followers and bring them to Savinia Loresong at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^Two of my men have already been killed trying to confine the magnataur called Gormok the Impaler
column2: yet the creature still rages. It howls for hours about being without its favorite snobold. If the Argent Crusade didn't wish to use this monster in the coliseum
column3: I'd slay it myself. Perhaps it's time to bring the beast its playthings. Take this net and travel to Garm's Bane in southeast Storm Peaks. It's just northeast of K3. Capture some of those snobolds and pray to the Light you've found the right one.

column1: Breakfast Of Champions^80^All^Argent Tournament^Tylos Dawnrunner^Tylos Dawnrunner^^^^Acquire 4 Jormungar Egg Sacs and bring them to Tylos Dawnrunner at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^Now that the coliseum is complete

The giant jormungar have perhaps the strangest diet; they grow strong by eating the eggs of their own kind and the best eggs come from deep jormungar. Take this drum to the Foot Steppes in central Storm Peaks and play them near the snow mounds you see there. The sound will rouse the deep jormungar. Kill them
column3: collect their egg sacs
column4: and return to the tournament grounds.

column1: Identifying the Remains^80^All^Argent Tournament^Kraken Tooth^Crusader Silverdawn^^^^Take the Kraken Tooth to Crusader Silverdawn as proof of your victory.^A whole tooth from a dead Kraken is a rare find indeed. Crusader Silverdawn will want to see this.
You've Really Done It This Time
column2: Kul^80^All^Argent Tournament^Narasi Snowdawn^Narasi Snowdawn^^^^Rescue Kul the Reckless and 4 Captive Aspirants from Deathspeaker's Watch and return to Narasi Snowdawn at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^Crusader Kul has gone and gotten himself into trouble again
column3: only this time he's not alone. When he saw the cultists making camp at Deathspeaker's Watch
column4: west of the tournament grounds
column5: Kul gathered the aspirants for an assault. Without reinforcements
column6: Kul and his followers were easily captured. I have no doubt that the cult will sacrifice the prisoners unless we can mount a rescue. Any of those cultists could carry keys to the black cages. Find the keys and free Kul and the captive aspirants.

column1: Relic of the Earthen Ring^30^All^Shaman^Siln Skychaser^Gotura Fourwinds^^^^Bring your four totems to Gotura Fourwinds in Orgrimmar.^You have progressed far in your training
column2: <name>. Now that you have mastered the four basic elements
column3: you must strive to keep all four in balance. There is a practical benefit to this discipline - with practice
column4: you may carry only a single relic instead of all four totems. Speak to Gotura Fourwinds at the Valley of Wisdom in Orgrimmar
column5: and hone your mastery of the elements.

column1: Drottinn Hrothgar^80^All^Argent Tournament^High Crusader Adelard^High Crusader Adelard^^^^High Crusader Adelard at the Argent Tournament Grounds wants you to defeat Drottinn Hrothgar.^The kvaldir
column2: seafaring vrykul who raid ships and coastal settlements
column3: have overrun a tuskarr island across the strait to the north. Their leader is a veteran raider
column4: Drottinn Hrothgar
column5: who seeks to control these seas. With him in power
column6: our shipments and troop transports will never be safe. We will be stranded here at the Lich King's mercy. Take this captured kvaldir war horn to the circle of tuskarr statues on the northeastern part of Hrothgar's Landing and use it to challenge the kvaldir leader.

column1: Mistcaller Yngvar^80^All^Argent Tournament^High Crusader Adelard^High Crusader Adelard^^^^High Crusader Adelard at the Argent Tournament Grounds wants you to kill Mistcaller Yngvar.^The Kvaldir have returned to the coasts of Northrend and if left unchecked
column2: they will prevent our supplies and reinforcements from arriving. One of them
column3: known as Mistcaller Yngvar
column4: has taken up residence in a cave on the western side of Hrothgar's Landing. There
column5: he manipulates the mists to conceal the Kvaldir and the sea beasts they command. Take this charm and travel across the strait north of the tournament grounds
column6: to Hrothgar's Landing. Find the mistcaller's cave and use the charm to reveal him.

column1: Ornolf The Scarred^80^All^Argent Tournament^High Crusader Adelard^High Crusader Adelard^^^^High Crusader Adelard at the Argent Tournament Grounds wants you to kill Ornolf the Scarred.^Ornolf the Scarred is a fearsome raider renowned among his Kvaldir brethren for raiding and capturing ships. From aboard Bor's Fury
column2: he and his crew attack our ships and steal our goods. Ornolf and his men are among those who slaughtered the inhabitants of a tuskarr island to the north and renamed it Hrothgar's Landing. His ship sits at anchor at the eastern end of the island's harbor. Take this captured banner and display it on his ship to provoke him into facing you in battle.

column1: Deathspeaker Kharos^80^All^Argent Tournament^High Crusader Adelard^High Crusader Adelard^^^^High Crusader Adelard at the Argent Tournament Grounds wants to you kill Deathspeaker Kharos.^The Cult of the Damned has redoubled its efforts to see us destroyed. They have grown bold and are massing their strength at Deathspeaker's Watch on the ridge west of the tournament grounds. The ruthless Deathspeaker Kharos has his men fortifying their positions
column2: preparing to unleash all of the cult's weapons. My men are preparing themselves and the valiants to defend the grounds
column3: but I want champions like you
column4: <name>
column5: to lead our efforts to blunt the attack. Find Deathspeaker Kharos and slay him.

column1: The Fate Of The Fallen^80^All^Argent Tournament^Crusader Silverdawn^Crusader Silverdawn^^^^Crusader Silverdawn wants you to bring peace to 6 Fallen Hero's Spirits.^The Argent Crusade is hardly the first force to challenge the Lich King. Our enemy turns spirits of the fallen against us. Their spirits wander the Valley of Fallen Heroes
column2: southwest of the grounds and between Aldur'thar and the Ironwall Rampart. The area is littered with discarded soul crystals
column3: used by the Scourge to control the spirits. Gather those soul crystals and use them with this Light-blessed relic to bestow the blessing of peace upon the spirits. They have more than earned their rest.

column1: Get Kraken!^80^All^Argent Tournament^Crusader Silverdawn^Crusader Silverdawn^^^^Crusader Silverdawn wants you to mount an Argent Hippogryph
column2: throw 6 Flaming Spears at the North Sea Kraken and take out 3 Vrykul Deepcallers.^The Sunreavers and Silver Covenant sent ships north to engage the Kvaldir at Hrothgar's Landing
column3: but were intercepted and detained by a Kvaldir Raiding vessel. To make matters worse
column4: the Kvaldir have found a way to call forth the dreaded Kraken that lives beneath the North Sea. If anyone on board is to get out alive
column5: that Kraken must be driven away and the Kvaldir's summoning ritual ... disrupted. Crusader
column6: take these spears and an Argent Hippogryph will take you to the battle.

column1: Relic of the Earthen Ring^30^All^Shaman^Sulaa^Farseer Eannu^^^^Bring your four totems to Farseer Eannu in Ironforge.^You have progressed far in your training
column2: <name>. Now that you have mastered the four basic elements
column3: you must strive to keep all four in balance. There is a practical benefit to this discipline - with practice
column4: you may carry only a single relic instead of all four totems. Speak to Farseer Eannu near the Great Forge in Ironforge. He will help you hone your mastery of the elements.

column1: What Do You Feed a Yeti
column2: Anyway?^80^All^Argent Tournament^Savinia Loresong^Savinia Loresong^^^^Savinia Loresong at the Argent Tournament Grounds wants you to bring her 3 pieces of North Sea Shark Meat.^The crusaders have captured a yeti that they're calling Icehowl. He's to be a participant in the coliseum battles and we've been asked to help with his training and upkeep. The crusaders weren't fond of my suggestion that we feed the beast surplus Sunreavers. The creature has a predilection for shark meat
column3: so I want you to fly down to the Silver Blade
column4: floating in the strait to the north. Get some fresh chum from one of the buckets on the boat
column5: then spread it in the water to attract sharks.

column1: Rescue at Sea^80^All^Argent Tournament^Girana the Blooded^Girana the Blooded^^^^Girana the Blooded at the Argent Tournament Grounds would like you to kill 8 Kvaldir Berserkers and 3 Kvaldir Harpooners aboard The Firehawk.^The Kvaldir have set up camp at Hrothgar's Landing
column2: the small island to the North. We sent Captain Aerthas Firehawk to the area
column3: but they ran into a Kvaldir Raiding party heading to the Tournament Grounds! The Firehawk is now under attack by the raiders and is vastly outnumbered. Get out there and show those Kvaldir why attacking the Sunreavers is a poor plan indeed. The Firehawk is between Hrothgar's Landing to the north and the Tournament Grounds
column4: on the western side of The Sea Reaver's Run.

column4: but we can learn from them

column6: where the seagoing Kvaldir have overrun an old tuskarr settlement and slain the villagers. Take this book and read the rites for the dead near the corpses of the villagers. It will allow their spirits to escape the mists engulfing the island and find peace.

column2: Anyway?^80^All^Argent Tournament^Tylos Dawnrunner^Tylos Dawnrunner^^^^Tylos Dawnrunner at the Argent Tournament Grounds wants you to bring him 3 pieces of North Sea Shark Meat.^The crusaders have captured a yeti that they're calling Icehowl. The crusaders weren't fond of my suggestion that we feed some Silver Covenant members to the beast. The creature prefers shark meat

column4: floating in the strait to the north. Get some fresh chum from one of the buckets on the boat

column1: Cardinal Ruby^65^All^Alchemy^Linzy Blackbolt^Linzy Blackbolt^^^^Linzy Blackbolt in Dalaran wants you to successfully transmute 5 epic gems with your alchemy skill. Acceptable transmutes include Ametrine
column2: Eye of Zul
column3: Dreadstone
column4: King's Amber
column5: and Majestic Zircon.^The Cardinal Ruby is said to be the finest gem in all of Northrend. It sparkles like a crystal rose under the sun. Before I teach you this recipe
column6: I ask that you perform five epic gem transmutes to prepare your mind. You can do any you like
column7: and even do the same transmute many times. Return to me when you are truly ready.

column1: Rescue at Sea^80^All^Argent Tournament^Narasi Snowdawn^Narasi Snowdawn^^^^Head out to The North Sea and kill 8 Vrykul Berserkers and 3 Vrykul Harpooners attacking The Wavecrest.^Champion
column2: Captain Wavecrest and her ship were sent north to disrupt the Kvaldir in Hrothgar's Landing when they were intercepted by a Kvaldir raiding party headed to the Tournament Grounds. Unfortunately
column3: the Kvaldir far outnumber the crew on board and are slowly taking over the ship. We need you to go north to The Wavecrest in The Sea Reaver's Run
column4: between the Tournament Grounds and Hrothgar's Landing and help the crew fend off the attack. You should see the ship on the east side of the pass.

column1: Writ of Merit^1^All^Jewelcrafting^Writ of Merit^Timothy Jones^^^^Deliver the Writ of Merit to Timothy Jones in Dalaran.^This fine parchment lists a great many accomplishments
column2: achieved by <name>
column3: in the tradition of jewelcrafting. Return this writ to Timothy Jones in Dalaran for a proper reward.

column1: Waterlogged Recipe^80^All^Dalaran^Waterlogged Recipe^Christi Stockton^^^^Bring the Waterlogged Recipe to Christi Stockton in the Dalaran city.^This appears to be the remains of a mixture for potent wine. Perhaps the proprietor of One More Glass in Dalaran would be interested in it....

The Call to Command^60^All^Eastern Plaguelands^Nathanos Blightcaller^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner^The Call to Command^^The Crimson Courier^Travel to the Undercity and speak with Lady Sylvanas Windrunner.^The order has come down
column2: <class>. Sylvanas herself has requested that I send my most 'capable' agents back to the Undercity for a highly sensitive tactical operation. Unfortunately
column3: my most capable agents were killed over three years ago. In their stead I have a collection of brain dead riff-raff. <Nathanos stares coldly at you.> Travel to the Undercity at once and report to the Dark Lady. Do not embarrass me
column4: <class>!

column1: The Crimson Courier^60^Horde^Eastern Plaguelands^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner^Nathanos Blightcaller^The Call to Command^^^Return to Eastern Plaguelands and track down the Crimson Courier. Kill the Courier and recover the Grand Crusader's Command.^We cannot attack the Scarlet Crusade's command directly; they are too well defended. But there's more than one way to skin a cat. They'll be nothing without their main force. The Deathstalkers have been collecting data on the activity of the Crusade outside of Stratholme. Each day
column2: a report is sent from their central command to Tyr's Hand. This report is the key
column3: <race>! Find the Crimson Courier and recover that report. Bring it to Nathanos.

column1: Battle of Hillsbrad^32^Horde^Hillsbrad Foothills^High Executor Darthalia^Bragor Bloodfist^Battle of Hillsbrad^^^Take Darthalia's Sealed Commendation to Bragor Bloodfist in the Undercity.^Because you fought with such valor and perseverance in the Battle of Hillsbrad
column2: I have written this commendation
column3: extolling your heroics in combat for the high command to recognize. Take this sealed commendation to Bragor Bloodfist in the Undercity. Go with pride
column4: <class>.

column1: An Unholy Alliance^36^Horde^Razorfen Downs^Small Scroll^Bragor Bloodfist^An Unholy Alliance^^^Take the Small Scroll to Bragor Bloodfist in the Undercity.^My Lady
column2: You know very well what it is we are offering. The opportunity for you to take the Barrens and the lands beyond is a great one. We simply want your aid in return. By aid we mean nothing more than your giving us the freedom to take action in the area. Please
column3: allow us to discuss this further. We have great power and are willing to share with those wise enough to join us. I will remain outside Razorfen Downs for the time being. Best Regards
column4: Ambassador Malcin

column1: An Unholy Alliance^36^Horde^Razorfen Downs^Bragor Bloodfist^Bragor Bloodfist^An Unholy Alliance^^^Bring Ambassador Malcin's Head to Bragor Bloodfist in the Undercity.^Supposedly this Malcin is outside Razorfen Downs. There's no question - he has to die. My contacts in Orgrimmar tell me their scouts have found signs of the Plague down there. The quilboar are showing signs of being plagued
column2: too; they're much more powerful. Whatever the Scourge are doing down there needs to end. Now. Find this Malcin and kill him. Report back here when he's dead.

column1: Into The Scarlet Monastery^42^Horde^Scarlet Monastery^Bragor Bloodfist^Bragor Bloodfist^^^^Kill High Inquisitor Whitemane
column2: Scarlet Commander Mograine
column3: Herod
column4: the Scarlet Champion and Houndmaster Loksey and then report back to Bragor Bloodfist in the Undercity.^One of my duties while I'm stationed here is to help the Forsaken take care of their borders
column5: and that
column6: <class>
column7: is exactly what you're going to do for me. I might live and breathe
column8: but the Scarlet Crusade will cut down my people as quickly as they will one of the undead. They're a problem here
column9: a big one
column10: and you're going to do something about it. Go to the Monastery and slay High Inquisitor Whitemane and her lieutenants.

column1: The Power to Destroy...^16^Horde^Ragefire Chasm^Bragor Bloodfist^Bragor Bloodfist^^^^Bring the books Spells of Shadow and Incantations from the Nether to Bragor Bloodfist in Undercity.^Listen up
column2: <class>. You may not know this
column3: but Orgrimmar's got a problem. Deep in Ragefire Chasm
column4: a sect of the Shadow Council called the Searing Blade performs their sinister work. They're mainly orcs
column5: and I can't trust sensitive information in the hands of the grunts there. That's where you come in. They should have two books in their possession. I want them kept out of the hands of the Searing Blade and the Forsaken alike. Bring them to me directly.

column1: A Cautious Return^73^All^Darnassus^Daros Moonlance^Archmage Mordent Evenshade^^^^Bring Daros' Journal to Mordent Evenshade in Darnassus.^A moment of your time
column2: <class>. Change is coming. It has drawn us out of the ruins of Eldre'Thalas and into the wide world once more. I have come to research this city and cannot stray from it
column3: but if you are inclined
column4: I have an errand for you. My colleague set out for Darnassus to speak with the High Priestess there
column5: that we might come to an understanding. Take this journal to Mordent Evenshade in the temple. It may help in his diplomacy mission.

column1: The Deathstalkers^13^Horde^Rogue^Mennet Carkad^Aleric Hawkins^The Deathstalkers^^^Deliver Andron's Ledger to Aleric Hawkins in the Hall of the Dark Lady in the Undercity.^The Syndicate? I would never have suspected. It seems the lords of Alterac have fallen far in the years since their betrayal. Hawkins will be pleased to learn of this
column2: and as you were so instrumental in this discovery
column3: it would be fitting if you were the one to deliver it to him. Ah
column4: and how could I forget? Welcome to the Deathstalkers.

column1: The Deathstalkers^13^Horde^Rogue^Mennet Carkad^Andron Gant^Mennet Carkad^^^Speak with Andron Gant in the Undercity.^The letter of introduction should be enough to convince Andron that you are the messenger he's been waiting for. I've met Andron before
column2: he doesn't quite have the mental capacity to be that suspicious. Our leader suspects that Andron has been providing aid to some other group. He wishes to know what organization this is and requires proof of it. I want you to speak with Andron
column3: and obtain this information. You'll find him at his shop near the Apothecarium.

column1: The Deathstalkers^13^Horde^Rogue^Mennet Carkad^Mennet Carkad^The Deathstalkers^Mennet Carkad^^Get Astor's Letter of Introduction and return it to Mennet Carkad in the Rogues' Quarter.^If you wish to join the Deathstalkers
column2: the Dark Lady's elite guard
column3: you will have to prove your worth. I will not lie to you
column4: <name>
column5: this task could mean your death. I have some things that need attending to. I require the personal effects of Astor Hadren
column6: a messenger who travels between Silverpine and the Undercity. I will leave the method of procurement to your discretion. It will be better for you if you know less of the nature of this business. Succeed and I shall tell you more.

column1: The Deathstalkers^13^Horde^Rogue^Andron Gant^Mennet Carkad^The Deathstalkers^^^Bring Andron's Ledger to Mennet Carkad in the Rogues' Quarter of Undercity.^You'll find the ledger with the information your employers seek on the bookshelf behind me. Deliver it with my regards
column2: and tell them that I would prefer it if they sent you
column3: if they find enough value that they should wish to continue our arrangement.

column1: The Battered Hilt^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Battered Hilt^Caladis Brightspear^The Battered Hilt^^^Bring the Battered Hilt to Caladis Brightspear at Quel'Delar's rest

column2: the XT-002 Deconstructor actually thinks that it is the keeper's son. Do not be fooled by its feigned innocence. It is a deadly machine! You will find the Deconstructor within Ulduar's Scrapyard. The Council of Six has decreed that XT-002 Deconstructor must die!

column1: Lord Jaraxxus Must Die!^80^All^Trial of the Crusader^Archmage Lan'dalock^Archmage Lan'dalock^^^^Kill Lord Jaraxxus.^Archmage Timear has foreseen a horrible event
column2: which is about to transpire. A foolish gnome warlock is about to accidentally summon an Eredar lord of the Burning Legion into the middle of the Trial of the Crusader. You must be there when it happens
column3: <class>. If Lord Jaraxxus escapes
column4: he will open a portal and the Burning Legion will spill forth into our world once more. The Council of Six has decreed that Lord Jaraxxus must die!

column1: Lord Marrowgar Must Die!^80^All^Icecrown Citadel^Archmage Lan'dalock^Archmage Lan'dalock^^^^Kill Lord Marrowgar.^Lord Marrowgar is the guardian of the Frozen Throne within the Spire Chamber. Pieced together by the Lich King from the bones of a thousand vanquished adventurers
column2: Marrowgar wields the power of the throne itself. Without the destruction of this bone wraith
column3: there is no hope of taking Icecrown Citadel. The Council of Six has decreed that Lord Marrowgar must die!

column1: The Pit of Saron^80^Horde^Pit of Saron^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner^Inside the Frozen Citadel^^^Meet Lady Sylvanas Windrunner inside the entrace to the Pit of Saron.^Quickly
column2: through the portal! I'll find you on the other side.

column1: The Pit of Saron^80^Alliance^^Lady Jaina Proudmoore^Lady Jaina Proudmoore^Inside the Frozen Citadel^^^Meet Lady Jaina Proudmoore just inside the Pit of Saron.^Quickly
column2: through the portal! I'll meet you on the other side.

column1: Deliverance from the Pit^80^Alliance^Pit of Saron^Martin Victus^Lady Jaina Proudmoore^Inside the Frozen Citadel^^^Kill Scourgelord Tyrannus.^We need to make our way up the main path and through the cave to Tyrannus' rise. There
column2: he will be forced to confront us there lest we make our way into the citadel proper. Go now
column3: <class>. My men and I will be there to stand by you when the confrontation with Tyrannus comes.

column1: Frostmourne^80^Alliance^^Lady Jaina Proudmoore^Lady Jaina Proudmoore^Inside the Frozen Citadel^^Wrath of the Lich King^Meet Lady Jaina Proudmoore at the entrance to the Halls of Reflection.^We must press on
column2: hero. We've come so far... we're so close to our goal. I must delay a moment to send Elandra back to the airship. I'm uncertain how we're going to escape with so many men lost and so few to keep our path in secure - we will need any help they can send. Continue on. I will meet you in the Halls of Reflection.

column1: Deliverance from the Pit^80^Horde^Warsong Offensive^Gorkun Ironskull^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner^Inside the Frozen Citadel^^^Kill Scourgelord Tyrannus.^We need to make our way up the main path and through the cave to Tyrannus' rise. There

column1: Frostmourne^80^Horde^^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner^Inside the Frozen Citadel^^Wrath of the Lich King^Meet Lady Sylvanas Windrunner inside the entrance to the Halls of Reflection.^Keep moving
column2: the sword is close. I need a moment to send one of my Dark Rangers back to the airship. With all of our fodder gone
column3: I will not be caught unprepared - we will need any help they can send. Go. I will meet you in the Halls of Reflection.

column1: The Lich King's Last Stand^80^All^Icecrown Citadel^Highlord Darion Mograine^Highlord Darion Mograine^^Shadowmourne...^^Highlord Darion Mograine in Icecrown Citadel wants you to kill the Lich King.^Shadowmourne; a newly forged weapon already steeped in this world's history
column2: reborn into an unrivaled destiny. With this weapon you bear a solemn responsibility
column3: and the time to carry out that charge is at hand. Take this weapon of myth and legend and march on the enemy. Avenge the countless heroes lost in his merciless campaign. Bring rest to their tortured souls. Steel yourself
column4: <class>
column5: and guide Shadowmourne to fulfill the purpose of its creation.

column1: Unholy Infusion^80^All^Icecrown Citadel^Highlord Darion Mograine^Highlord Darion Mograine^Unholy Infusion^A Feast of Souls^Blood Infusion^Highlord Darion Mograine wants you to infuse Shadow's Edge with Unholy power and slay Professor Putricide.^Before your weapon can reach its full potential it must be endowed with its signature powers. First among them is unholiness. You must seek out and defeat the one called Professor Putricide
column2: but his death is not your only goal. You must use his resources against him. Find a way to absorb his mutated slime. Use the foul substance to infuse your weapon with the power of the unholy. Only when this has been done shall I reveal your next task.

column1: Blood Infusion^80^All^Icecrown Citadel^Highlord Darion Mograine^Highlord Darion Mograine^Unholy Infusion^^Frost Infusion^Highlord Darion Mograine wants you to infuse Shadow's Edge with blood and defeat Queen Lana'thel.^Your weapon is ready to be endowed with the power of blood. You must face Queen Lana'thel in battle and subject yourself to her Blood Mirror. This will cause Shadow's Edge to drink the blood of the nearest living being. That being would be you
column2: <race>. Once the blade has been thus awakened
column3: allow the Queen's Frenzied Bloodthirst to take hold of you
column4: feed the blade thrice to sate it
column5: and then give the queen an ignominious death. May her screams pierce the ears of the Lich King as he awaits his fate.

column1: Frost Infusion^80^All^Icecrown Citadel^Highlord Darion Mograine^Highlord Darion Mograine^Unholy Infusion^^The Splintered Throne^Highlord Darion Mograine has instructed you to slay Sindragosa after subjecting yourself to 4 of her breath attacks while wielding Shadow's Edge.^Shadow's Edge is prepared to receive its final infusion of power. Sindragosa
column2: the enemy's own mount
column3: must fall. But before she is brought down
column4: you must sustain four of her frozen breath attacks without tasting death. Without his dragon
column5: nothing shall stand between you and the Lich King.

column1: A Victory For The Silver Covenant^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Caladis Brightspear^Justicar Mariel Trueheart^The Purification of Quel'Delar^^^Bring the Restored Quel'Delar to Justicar Mariel Trueheart at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^In spite of Queen Lana'thel's boasting
column2: you have restored Quel'Delar
column3: <name>. Long have we dreamt of reclaiming Quel'Delar. The Silver Covenant
column4: and indeed all quel'dorei owe you a debt of gratitude. As a <class>
column5: the sword seems to know you lack the training to wield it and hasn't bonded to you. Where
column6: then
column7: will its next master come from? Perhaps the Argent Crusade can find one. Go north to the Argent Tournament Grounds and present the sword to Justicar Mariel Trueheart on behalf of the Silver Covenant.

column1: A Victory For The Silver Covenant^80^Alliance^Icecrown^Caladis Brightspear^Vereesa Windrunner^The Purification of Quel'Delar^^^Bring the Restored Quel'Delar to Vereesa Windrunner at the Violet Citadel in Dalaran.^In spite of Queen Lana'thel's boasting
column2: you have restored Quel'Delar
column3: <name>. Long have we dreamt of reclaiming Quel'Delar. The Silver Covenant
column4: and indeed all quel'dorei owe you a debt of gratitude. Vereesa Windrunner
column5: the leader of the Silver Covenant
column6: asked to see you after you returned from the Sunwell. Take Quel'Delar with you and go to Dalaran's Violet Citadel where she waits
column7: <name>.

column1: A Victory For The Sunreavers^80^Blood Elf^Icecrown^Myralion Sunblaze^Justicar Mariel Trueheart^The Purification of Quel'Delar^^^Bring the Restored Quel'Delar to Justicar Mariel Trueheart at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^At last
column2: Quel'Delar is restored for the glory of the Sunreavers and the sin'dorei! All of Silvermoon will celebrate you as a hero
column3: <name>. As a <class>
column4: the sword seems to know you lack the training to wield it and hasn't bonded to you. Where
column5: then
column6: will its next master come from? No worthy sin'dorei has come forward. Let us seek the Argent Crusade's counsel. Go north to the Argent Tournament Grounds and present the sword to Justicar Mariel Trueheart on behalf of the Sunreavers.

column1: A Victory For The Sunreavers^80^Orc
column2: Undead
column3: ^Icecrown^Myralion Sunblaze^Justicar Mariel Trueheart^The Purification of Quel'Delar^^^Bring the Restored Quel'Delar to Justicar Mariel Trueheart at the Argent Tournament Grounds.^At last
column4: Quel'Delar is restored for the glory of the Sunreavers! All the Horde will celebrate you as a hero
column5: <name>. As a <class>
column6: the sword seems to know you lack the training to wield it and hasn't bonded to you. Where
column7: then
column8: will its next master come from? I will not conceal my disappointment; I had hoped it would be a worthy sin'dorei. Let us seek the Argent Crusade's counsel. Go north to the Argent Tournament Grounds and present the sword to Justicar Mariel Trueheart on behalf of the Sunreavers.

column1: A Victory For The Sunreavers^80^Blood Elf^Icecrown^Myralion Sunblaze^Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^The Purification of Quel'Delar^^^Bring the Restored Quel'Delar to Archmage Aethas Sunreaver at the Violet Citadel in Dalaran.^At last
column2: Quel'Delar is restored for the glory of the Sunreavers and the sin'dorei! All of Silvermoon will proclaim you a hero
column3: as will all of the Horde. Archmage Aethas Sunreaver
column4: the leader of the Sunreavers
column5: asked to see you after you returned from the Sunwell. Travel to the Violet Citadel in Dalaran as soon as you can
column6: <name> and bring Quel'Delar with you. The archmage wishes to congratulate you personally!

column1: A Victory For The Sunreavers^80^Orc
column2: Undead
column3: ^Icecrown^Myralion Sunblaze^Archmage Aethas Sunreaver^The Purification of Quel'Delar^^^Bring the Restored Quel'Delar to Archmage Aethas Sunreaver at the Violet Citadel in Dalaran.^At last
column4: Quel'Delar is restored for the glory of the Sunreavers and the Horde! This is a blessing for our efforts against the Lich King. Archmage Aethas Sunreaver
column5: the leader of the Sunreavers
column6: asked to see you after you returned from the Sunwell. Travel to the Violet Citadel in Dalaran as soon as you can
column7: <name> and bring Quel'Delar with you. The archmage wishes to congratulate you personally!

column1: Wrath of the Lich King^80^Horde^Warsong Offensive^Dark Ranger Loralen^Lady Sylvanas Windrunner^^Frostmourne^^Find Lady Sylvanas Windrunner and escape the Halls of Reflection^Uther knew a great deal about how Arthas might be defeated. It's hard to believe that there is much hope of defeating Arthas upon the steps of his own throne. And who will take up the crown of Lich King if it comes to that? Many questions remain
column2: but the answers that you've uncovered may be critical to ensuring Arthas' defeat. You need to find Sylvanas and escape the Lich King while there's still time.

column1: Attack on Camp Narache^4^Horde^Mulgore^Dirt-stained Map^Chief Hawkwind^^^^Bring the Bristleback Attack Plans to Chief Hawkwind in Camp Narache.^After carefully evaluating the map
column2: you realize that what you discovered are the plans made by the Bristleback warchief for an extended siege on Camp Narache. Surely Chief Hawkwind could use this information!

column1: Deprogramming^80^All^Icecrown Citadel^Infiltrator Minchar^Infiltrator Minchar^^^^Defeat Lady Deathwhisper while ensuring that Darnavan survives.^We had hoped to place a man on the inside of the Cult of the Damned
column2: to give us an inside angle on the Lich King's machinations
column3: but we... underestimated the persuasive powers of Arthas and his dark minister
column4: Lady Deathwhisper. Our man
column5: Darnavan
column6: is one of them now. If you plan on fighting your way through the Oratory ahead
column7: please keep your eyes peeled for Darnavan. If you can bring him back to us alive
column8: we can attempt to reverse the Cult's brainwashing.

column1: Securing the Ramparts^80^All^Icecrown Citadel^Kor'kron Lieutenant^Kor'kron Lieutenant^^^^Slay the Rotting Frost Giant.^As if this place weren't enough of a madhouse to begin with
column2: we're fighting a war on two fronts up here
column3: with the Scourge on one side and those blasted Alliance dogs on our other flank! We are here to clear a safe landing for our vessels
column4: but a behemoth of a giant on the other side of the Ramparts is hurling debris at anything that comes close and keeping our smaller ships at bay. I'll be honest -- he's a bit much for us to handle
column5: but you and your companions look up to the task.

column1: Securing the Ramparts^80^All^Icecrown Citadel^Skybreaker Lieutenant^Skybreaker Lieutenant^^^^Slay the Rotting Frost Giant.^As if this place weren't enough of a madhouse to begin with
column2: we're fighting a war on two fronts up here
column3: with the Scourge on one side and those blasted Horde dogs on our other flank! We are here to clear a safe landing for our vessels

column1: Respite for a Tormented Soul^80^All^Icecrown Citadel^Valithria Dreamwalker^Kalecgos^^^^Use the Life Crystals to preserve Sindragosa's Essence.^Take this Life Crystal
column2: and have your companions take one as well. It contains potent energies from the verdant Dragonshrine in Dragonblight
column3: and it was my own secret to resisting the dark magics of this place for so long. When you face Sindragosa
column4: battle her until she is weakened
column5: and then have your companions use these Crystals to coax out the essence that is dormant within her. If you then defeat her
column6: you should be able to recover it and return it to Wyrmrest Temple in Dragonblight.

column1: Residue Rendezvous^80^All^Icecrown Citadel^Alchemist Adrianna^Alchemist Adrianna^^^^Return to Alchemist Adrianna while infected with Orange and Green Blight.^Professor Putricide has been holed up in his foul laboratory
column2: experimenting and refining increasingly lethal strains of blight to be used against us. If only we could obtain pure samples of the toxins
column3: our researchers could concoct an antidote that would save countless lives. But there's a catch -- a proper sample will need to mix two active strains within a living host. Should you have the... misfortune... of becoming such a host
column4: please return here immediately so that we can harvest you for study.

column1: Blood Quickening^80^All^Icecrown Citadel^Alrin the Agile^Alrin the Agile^^^^Rescue Infiltrator Minchar before he is executed.^These Scourge bloodsuckers -- San'layn they call themselves - give me the creeps. We've had one of our best men keeping an eye on them. But this morning he got sloppy and got himself taken prisoner. He's being interrogated by the Queen herself right now
column2: and his cries echo through the Crimson Halls. Please
column3: save him before it's too late!

column1: Personal Property^80^All^Icecrown Citadel^Sealed Chest^Highlord Darion Mograine^^^Mograine's Reunion
column2: Jaina's Locket
column3: Muradin's Lament
column4: Sylvanas' Vengeance
column5: The Lightbringer's Redemption^Bring the Sealed Chest to Highlord Darion Mograine in Icecrown Citadel.^You can detect no hinges or openings on this box. Were it not for the shifting of items inside
column6: it could easily be mistaken for solid metal. If anyone could know the method of its opening
column7: it would be Highlord Mograine.

column1: Basic Orders^1^All^Dun Morogh^Captain Tread Sparknozzle^Captain Tread Sparknozzle^A Few Good Gnomes^^Vent Horizon^Follow Drill Sergeant Steamcrank's cues and then report back to Captain Tread Sparknozzle.^Hey! You look like you could give us a hand! If you're willing to help our cause
column2: we have to get you through training. Gnome training is brutal and rigorous
column3: so I hope you're ready. Head over to Drill Sergeant Steamcrank and he'll walk you through what you need to know. Make sure you follow his orders when he gives them
column4: or else you'll never make it I'm warning you though
column5: it's tough over there. Come back to see me
column6: if you make it.

column1: Vent Horizon^1^All^Dun Morogh^Pilot Muzzlesprock^Pilot Muzzlesprock^^Basic Orders^^Use Pilot Muzzlesprock's flying machine to toss Radiageigatrons at the vents surrounding Gnomeregan.^We thought that we could wait for the radiation to subside around Gnomeregan
column2: but it doesn't appear to be getting better. If we want to take back our city
column3: we need to make sure it's safe for our troops to enter. Take these Radiageigatrons
column4: hop in 'Thunderflash' here
column5: and toss them at the ventilation shafts outside of Gnomeregan. They'll report the radiation levels directly to me.

column1: Prepping the Speech^1^All^Dun Morogh^Toby Zeigear^Toby Zeigear^^Press Fire^Words for Delivery
column2: Words for Delivery^Use the Gnomish Playback Device in front of Ozzie Togglevolt north of Kharanos
column3: Milli Featherwhistle at Steelgrill Depot and Tog Rustsprocket outside the Kharanos Inn. Return to Toby Ziegear when all the speeches have been given.^High Tinker Mekkatorque asked me to write a speech that he could give before the battle starts
column4: but I just can't tell which draft is good and which ones just stink. Could you try some of them out on the local gnome residents? This device creates an image of Mekkatorque saying a few lines from each of my speech drafts. Let me know which one works
column5: okay?

column1: Words for Delivery^75^All^Dun Morogh^Toby Zeigear^Captain Tread Sparknozzle^Words for Delivery^Prepping the Speech^^Give the speech to Captain Tread Sparknozzle at Steelgrill Depot.^Here we go. This is the speech
column2: <name>! It has everything to be a great battle starter: It's inspirational
column3: has eloquent language and speaks directly to gnomes. Never has a finer speech been written! Turn this in to Captain Tread Sparknozzle and get some transportation to High Tinker Mekkatorque!

column1: Da Perfect Spies^1^All^Durotar^Vanira^Vanira^Da Perfect Spies^^^Capture 5 Sen'jin Frogs and attune them to Vanira's sight at her Sentry Totem.^Now
column2: it would be foolish to go in blind 'ere
column3: so I be creatin' some tiny spies to gather information for Vol'jin. He got to know what's goin' on over on de islands. I could use da help
column4: if you be feelin' up to it. I tell ya how it's done. First
column5: ya gotta catch de frogs. Dey like to stay in de shade of da palm trees around Sen'jin. Once ya have de frogs
column6: bring 'em over here to my sentry totem an' attune dem to me sight.

column1: Zalazane's Fall^78^All^Durotar^Vol'jin^Vol'jin^Preparin' For Battle^^^Help Vol'jin take back the Echo Isles and kill Zalazane.^De time for battle is now! We'd be headin' ova to da islands soon
column2: so you'd betta be ready. Zalazane doesn't have much time left.

column1: Frogs Away!^1^All^Durotar^Vanira^Vanira^Da Perfect Spies^^Trollin' For Volunteers^While riding a bat
column2: use the Sack o' Frogs to place 12 attuned frogs on the markers in the Echo Isles.^Wit de frogs ready to go
column3: I be needin' ya to help me send 'em out to the isles. On de eastern side of Sen'jin Village
column4: ya can find Handler Marnlek. He be handlin' all the bats for Vol'jin's scouts and he can loan ya a bat to get ya out to de isles. Take dis sack' o frogs with ya. I been askin' de spirits for guidance. Dey've sent smoke to show ya where I need de eyes most. While ridin' de bat
column5: reach into de sack and toss de frogs toward de white smoke.

column1: Trollin' For Volunteers^1^All^Durotar^Champion Uru'zin^Champion Uru'zin^^Frogs Away!^Lady Of Da Tigers^Use Vol'jin's War Drums to recruit 5 Troll Citizens in Razor Hill.^Vol'jin has given me his war drums and put me in charge of trainin' da new recruits here. Only problem is we be short on new recruits. Supposin' I loaned ya dis drum
column2: would ya use it to sound de call to war on Vol'jin's behalf in Razor Hill? If ya could even inspire just a few trolls to join da cause
column3: it would make a difference. Once ya've convinced dem to volunteer
column4: bring dem back to me for trainin'. Go over an' talk to Handler Marnlek to de south. He can lend you a bat for de ride to Razor Hill.

column1: Lady Of Da Tigers^1^All^Durotar^Vanira^Vol'jin^Lady Of Da Tigers^Trollin' For Volunteers^^While imbued with the Spirit of the Tiger
column2: lure the Tiger Matriarch out of hiding and use your new abilities to best it in combat.^Remember de frogs ya made into me eyes and ears? Well
column3: dey've found somethin' interestin'. On an island to de southeast
column4: dey've spied a tiger even de other cats seem to fear. Dis tiger
column5: I've never seen anythin' like it. It hunts wit' da instincts of a cat
column6: but de mind of a person. It could be a powerful spirit and a strong ally. I'll be callin' down the spirit o' the tiger upon ya. Use its gifts to locate this cat and challenge it. See if ya can win its aid in our battle for the isles.

column1: Dance Of De Spirits^1^All^Durotar^Vol'jin^Vol'jin^Lady Of Da Tigers^^Preparin' For Battle^Talk to Witch Doctor Hez'tok near the circle of ritual dancers outside Sen'jin Village when you're ready to consult the omens.^De time has come to start thinkin' about when to make our move. Champion Uru'zin tells me his men be ready. You and Vanira done good work gatherin' information on de enemy and findin' us new allies. Now
column2: we read de omens. We find out when to launch de attack. Find Witch Doctor Hez'tok near the circle of ritual dancers. He be startin' de ritual as soon as ya be ready.

column1: Preparin' For Battle^75^All^Durotar^Champion Uru'zin^Vol'jin^Preparin' For Battle^Dance Of De Spirits^^Speak to Handler Marnlek for a flight to the staging area. Meet Vol'jin on the island east of the war camp.^Vol'jin be gatherin' his gear and readyin' de warriors. He ask me to tell ya to meet with him an' Vanira on de island to de east. From dere
column2: he and de warriors will launch de attack on Zalazane. May de ancestors go wit' you
column3: <name>. Without ya
column4: dis campaign would only be a shadow of what it become. Speak to Handler Marnlek
column5: just to de south
column6: an' he give you a bat to fly out to de stagin' area.

column1: Words for Delivery^1^All^Dun Morogh^Toby Zeigear^Captain Tread Sparknozzle^^Prepping the Speech^^Give the speech to Captain Tread Sparknozzle at Steelgrill Depot.^Here we go. This is the speech
column2: <name>! It has everything to be a great battle starter: It's inspirational
column3: has eloquent language and speaks directly to gnomes. Never has a finer speech been written! Turn this in to Captain Tread Sparknozzle and see if there's anything else he needs of you.

column1: Trouble at Wyrmrest^82^All^Dragonblight^Rhonin^Krasus^Trouble at Wyrmrest^^^Speak with Krasus at Wyrmrest Temple in Dragonblight.^My old friend Krasus sends word of dire happenings at Wyrmrest
column2: in Dragonblight. His missive was brief
column3: but it seems that there has been some sort of attack on the Ruby Sanctum beneath the Temple. Pressing business here in Dalaran keeps me from attending to the matter personally
column4: but I have heard word of your exploits in the Lich King's Citadel and you are doubtless up to the task -- perhaps you could assist Krasus in my stead?

column1: Assault on the Sanctum^82^All^The Ruby Sanctum^Krasus^Sanctum Guardian Xerestrasza^Trouble at Wyrmrest^^^Investigate the Ruby Sanctum beneath Wyrmrest Temple.^<race>
column2: something terrible has transpired within the Ruby Sanctum beneath the Temple. The entry to the Sanctum is in ruins
column3: and its guardians violently slain. We sent scouts to investigate
column4: but they have not returned. I cannot help but fear the worst. Enter the Ruby Sanctum and discover what has befallen the home of my flight. Once we have more information
column5: we can plan our next steps accordingly.

column1: The Twilight Destroyer^82^All^Dragonblight^Sanctum Guardian Xerestrasza^Krasus^Trouble at Wyrmrest^^^Defeat Halion and repel the invasion of the Ruby Sanctum.^This was no reckless attack
column2: but rather a carefully orchestrated strike against the heart of the Red Dragonflight. Zarithrian
column3: on the bluff over there
column4: is overseeing the assault
column5: but the true leader of this force is a brash and powerful Twilight dragon named Halion. Not since Dargonax has a full-grown spawn of Sinestra's twisted experiments been seen. Slay him
